1:1 In the begin god creat the heaven and the earth.

1:2 and the earth wa without form, and void; and dark wa upon
th face of the deep. and the spirit of god move upon the face of the
waters.

1:3 and god said, let there be light: and there wa light.

1:4 and god saw the light, that it wa good: and god divid the light
from the darkness.

1:5 and god call the light day, and the dark he call night.
and the even and the morn were the first day.

1:6 and god said, let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters,
and let it divid the water from the waters.

1:7 and god made the firmament, and divid the water which were
und the firmament from the water which were abov the firmament:
and it wa so.

1:8 and god call the firmament heaven. and the even and the
morn were the second day.

1:9 and god said, let the water under the heaven be gather together
unto one place, and let the dri land appear: and it wa so.

1:10 and god call the dri land earth; and the gather togeth of
th water call he seas: and god saw that it wa good.

1:11 and god said, let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding
seed, and the fruit tree yield fruit after hi kind, whose seed is
in itself, upon the earth: and it wa so.

1:12 and the earth brought forth grass, and herb yield seed after
hi kind, and the tree yield fruit, whose seed wa in itself, after
hi kind: and god saw that it wa good.

1:13 and the even and the morn were the third day.

1:14 and god said, let there be light in the firmament of the heaven
to divid the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for
seasons, and for days, and years: 1:15 and let them be for light in
th firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was
so.

1:16 and god made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day,
and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the star also.

1:17 and god set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light
upon the earth, 1:18 and to rule over the day and over the night, and
to divid the light from the darkness: and god saw that it wa good.

1:19 and the even and the morn were the fourth day.

1:20 and god said, let the water bring forth abundantli the moving
creatur that hath life, and fowl that may fli abov the earth in the
open firmament of heaven.

1:21 and god creat great whales, and everi live creatur that
moveth, which the water brought forth abundantly, after their kind,
and everi wing fowl after hi kind: and god saw that it wa good.

1:22 and god bless them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill
th water in the seas, and let fowl multipli in the earth.

1:23 and the even and the morn were the fifth day.

1:24 and god said, let the earth bring forth the live creatur after
hi kind, cattle, and creep thing, and beast of the earth after his
kind: and it wa so.

1:25 and god made the beast of the earth after hi kind, and cattle
aft their kind, and everi thing that creepeth upon the earth after
hi kind: and god saw that it wa good.

1:26 and god said, let us make man in our image, after our likeness:
and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl
of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over
everi creep thing that creepeth upon the earth.

1:27 So god creat man in hi own image, in the imag of god created
h him; male and femal creat he them.

1:28 and god bless them, and god said unto them, Be fruitful, and
multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdu it: and have dominion
ov the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every
liv thing that moveth upon the earth.

1:29 and god said, behold, I have given you everi herb bear seed,
which is upon the face of all the earth, and everi tree, in the which
i the fruit of a tree yield seed; to you it shall be for meat.

1:30 and to everi beast of the earth, and to everi fowl of the air,
and to everi thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is
life, I have given everi green herb for meat: and it wa so.

1:31 and god saw everi thing that he had made, and, behold, it was
veri good. and the even and the morn were the sixth day.

2:1 thu the heaven and the earth were finished, and all the host of
them.

2:2 and on the seventh day god end hi work which he had made; and
h rest on the seventh day from all hi work which he had made.

2:3 and god bless the seventh day, and sanctifi it: becaus that
in it he had rest from all hi work which god creat and made.

2:4 these are the gener of the heaven and of the earth when
they were created, in the day that the lord god made the earth and the
heavens, 2:5 and everi plant of the field befor it wa in the earth,
and everi herb of the field befor it grew: for the lord god had not
caus it to rain upon the earth, and there wa not a man to till the
ground.

2:6 but there went up a mist from the earth, and water the whole
fac of the ground.

2:7 and the lord god form man of the dust of the ground, and
breath into hi nostril the breath of life; and man becam a living
soul.

2:8 and the lord god plant a garden eastward in eden; and there he
put the man whom he had formed.

2:9 and out of the ground made the lord god to grow everi tree that is
pleas to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the
midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledg of good and evil.

2:10 and a river went out of eden to water the garden; and from thence
it wa parted, and becam into four heads.

2:11 the name of the first is pison: that is it which compasseth the
whol land of havilah, where there is gold; 2:12 and the gold of that
land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.

2:13 and the name of the second river is gihon: the same is it that
compasseth the whole land of ethiopia.

2:14 and the name of the third river is hiddekel: that is it which
goeth toward the east of assyria. and the fourth river is euphrates.

2:15 and the lord god took the man, and put him into the garden of
eden to dress it and to keep it.

2:16 and the lord god command the man, saying, Of everi tree of the
garden thou mayest freeli eat: 2:17 but of the tree of the knowledge
of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou
eatest thereof thou shalt sure die.

2:18 and the lord god said, It is not good that the man should be
alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

2:19 and out of the ground the lord god form everi beast of the
field, and everi fowl of the air; and brought them unto adam to see
what he would call them: and whatsoev adam call everi living
creature, that wa the name thereof.

2:20 and adam gave name to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air,
and to everi beast of the field; but for adam there wa not found an
help meet for him.

2:21 and the lord god caus a deep sleep to fall upon adam, and he
slept: and he took one of hi ribs, and close up the flesh instead
thereof; 2:22 and the rib, which the lord god had taken from man, made
h a woman, and brought her unto the man.

2:23 and adam said, thi is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my
flesh: she shall be call woman, becaus she wa taken out of man.

2:24 therefor shall a man leav hi father and hi mother, and shall
cleav unto hi wife: and they shall be one flesh.

2:25 and they were both naked, the man and hi wife, and were not
ashamed.

3:1 now the serpent wa more subtil than ani beast of the field which
th lord god had made. and he said unto the woman, yea, hath god said,
y shall not eat of everi tree of the garden?  3:2 and the woman said
unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the tree of the garden:
3:3 but of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden,
god hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest
y die.

3:4 and the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not sure die: 3:5
for god doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eye shall
b opened, and ye shall be as gods, know good and evil.

3:6 and when the woman saw that the tree wa good for food, and that
it wa pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desir to make one
wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto
h husband with her; and he did eat.

3:7 and the eye of them both were opened, and they knew that they
wer naked; and they sew fig leav together, and made themselves
aprons.

3:8 and they heard the voic of the lord god walk in the garden in
th cool of the day: and adam and hi wife hid themselv from the
pres of the lord god amongst the tree of the garden.

3:9 and the lord god call unto adam, and said unto him, where art
thou?  3:10 and he said, I heard thi voic in the garden, and I was
afraid, becaus I wa naked; and I hid myself.

3:11 and he said, who told thee that thou wast naked? hast thou eaten
of the tree, whereof I command thee that thou shouldest not eat?
3:12 and the man said, the woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she
gav me of the tree, and I did eat.

3:13 and the lord god said unto the woman, what is thi that thou hast
done? and the woman said, the serpent beguil me, and I did eat.

3:14 and the lord god said unto the serpent, becaus thou hast done
this, thou art curs abov all cattle, and abov everi beast of the
field; upon thi belli shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the
day of thi life: 3:15 and I will put enmiti between thee and the
woman, and between thi seed and her seed; it shall bruis thi head,
and thou shalt bruis hi heel.

3:16 unto the woman he said, I will greatli multipli thi sorrow and
thi conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy
desir shall be to thi husband, and he shall rule over thee.

3:17 and unto adam he said, becaus thou hast hearken unto the voice
of thi wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I command thee,
saying, thou shalt not eat of it: curs is the ground for thi sake;
in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the day of thi life; 3:18 thorns
also and thistl shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the
herb of the field; 3:19 In the sweat of thi face shalt thou eat bread,
til thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for
dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.

3:20 and adam call hi wife' name eve; becaus she wa the mother
of all living.

3:21 unto adam also and to hi wife did the lord god make coat of
skins, and cloth them.

3:22 and the lord god said, behold, the man is becom as one of us, to
know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth hi hand, and take also
of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever: 3:23 therefor the
lord god sent him forth from the garden of eden, to till the ground
from whenc he wa taken.

3:24 So he drove out the man; and he place at the east of the garden
of eden cherubims, and a flame sword which turn everi way, to keep
th way of the tree of life.

4:1 and adam knew eve hi wife; and she conceived, and bare cain, and
said, I have gotten a man from the lord.

4:2 and she again bare hi brother abel. and abel wa a keeper of
sheep, but cain wa a tiller of the ground.

4:3 and in process of time it came to pass, that cain brought of the
fruit of the ground an offer unto the lord.

4:4 and abel, he also brought of the firstl of hi flock and of
th fat thereof. and the lord had respect unto abel and to his
offering: 4:5 but unto cain and to hi offer he had not respect.
and cain wa veri wroth, and hi counten fell.

4:6 and the lord said unto cain, whi art thou wroth? and whi is thy
counten fallen?  4:7 If thou doest well, shalt thou not be
accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. and unto
the shall be hi desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

4:8 and cain talk with abel hi brother: and it came to pass, when
they were in the field, that cain rose up against abel hi brother,
and slew him.

4:9 and the lord said unto cain, where is abel thi brother? and he
said, I know not: Am I my brother' keeper?  4:10 and he said, what
hast thou done? the voic of thi brother' blood crieth unto me from
th ground.

4:11 and now art thou curs from the earth, which hath open her
mouth to receiv thi brother' blood from thi hand; 4:12 when thou
tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her
strength; a fugit and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

4:13 and cain said unto the lord, My punish is greater than I can
bear.

4:14 behold, thou hast driven me out thi day from the face of the
earth; and from thi face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugit and
a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that everi one
that findeth me shall slay me.

4:15 and the lord said unto him, therefor whosoev slayeth cain,
veng shall be taken on him sevenfold. and the lord set a mark
upon cain, lest ani find him should kill him.

4:16 and cain went out from the presenc of the lord, and dwelt in the
land of nod, on the east of eden.

4:17 and cain knew hi wife; and she conceived, and bare enoch: and he
build a city, and call the name of the city, after the name of his
son, enoch.

4:18 and unto enoch wa born irad: and irad begat mehujael: and
mehujael begat methusael: and methusael begat lamech.

4:19 and lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one wa adah,
and the name of the other zillah.

4:20 and adah bare jabal: he wa the father of such as dwell in tents,
and of such as have cattle.

4:21 and hi brother' name wa jubal: he wa the father of all such
a handl the harp and organ.

4:22 and zillah, she also bare tubalcain, an instruct of every
artific in brass and iron: and the sister of tubalcain wa naamah.

4:23 and lamech said unto hi wives, adah and zillah, hear my voice;
y wive of lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to
mi wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

4:24 If cain shall be aveng sevenfold, truli lamech seventi and
sevenfold.

4:25 and adam knew hi wife again; and she bare a son, and call his
nam seth: for god, said she, hath appoint me anoth seed instead
of abel, whom cain slew.

4:26 and to seth, to him also there wa born a son; and he call his
nam enos: then began men to call upon the name of the lord.

5:1 thi is the book of the gener of adam. In the day that god
creat man, in the like of god made he him; 5:2 male and female
cr he them; and bless them, and call their name adam, in the
day when they were created.

5:3 and adam live an hundr and thirti years, and begat a son in his
own likeness, and after hi image; and call hi name seth: 5:4 and
th day of adam after he had begotten seth were eight hundr years:
and he begat son and daughters: 5:5 and all the day that adam lived
wer nine hundr and thirti years: and he died.

5:6 and seth live an hundr and five years, and begat enos: 5:7 and
seth live after he begat eno eight hundr and seven years, and
begat son and daughters: 5:8 and all the day of seth were nine
hundr and twelv years: and he died.

5:9 and eno live nineti years, and begat cainan: 5:10 and eno lived
aft he begat cainan eight hundr and fifteen years, and begat sons
and daughters: 5:11 and all the day of eno were nine hundr and
fiv years: and he died.

5:12 and cainan live seventi year and begat mahalaleel: 5:13 and
cainan live after he begat mahalaleel eight hundr and forti years,
and begat son and daughters: 5:14 and all the day of cainan were
nin hundr and ten years: and he died.

5:15 and mahalaleel live sixti and five years, and begat jared: 5:16
and mahalaleel live after he begat jare eight hundr and thirty
years, and begat son and daughters: 5:17 and all the day of
mahalaleel were eight hundr nineti and five years: and he died.

5:18 and jare live an hundr sixti and two years, and he begat
enoch: 5:19 and jare live after he begat enoch eight hundr years,
and begat son and daughters: 5:20 and all the day of jare were nine
hundr sixti and two years: and he died.

5:21 and enoch live sixti and five years, and begat methuselah: 5:22
and enoch walk with god after he begat methuselah three hundred
years, and begat son and daughters: 5:23 and all the day of enoch
wer three hundr sixti and five years: 5:24 and enoch walk with
god: and he wa not; for god took him.

5:25 and methuselah live an hundr eighti and seven years, and begat
lamech.

5:26 and methuselah live after he begat lamech seven hundr eighty
and two years, and begat son and daughters: 5:27 and all the day of
methuselah were nine hundr sixti and nine years: and he died.

5:28 and lamech live an hundr eighti and two years, and begat a
son: 5:29 and he call hi name noah, saying, thi same shall comfort
u concern our work and toil of our hands, becaus of the ground
which the lord hath cursed.

5:30 and lamech live after he begat noah five hundr nineti and five
years, and begat son and daughters: 5:31 and all the day of lamech
wer seven hundr seventi and seven years: and he died.

5:32 and noah wa five hundr year old: and noah begat shem, ham,
and japheth.

6:1 and it came to pass, when men began to multipli on the face of the
earth, and daughter were born unto them, 6:2 that the son of god saw
th daughter of men that they were fair; and they took them wive of
al which they chose.

6:3 and the lord said, My spirit shall not alway strive with man, for
that he also is flesh: yet hi day shall be an hundr and twenty
years.

6:4 there were giant in the earth in those days; and also after that,
when the son of god came in unto the daughter of men, and they bare
children to them, the same becam mighti men which were of old, men of
renown.

6:5 and god saw that the wicked of man wa great in the earth, and
that everi imagin of the thought of hi heart wa onli evil
continually.

6:6 and it repent the lord that he had made man on the earth, and it
griev him at hi heart.

6:7 and the lord said, I will destroy man whom I have creat from the
fac of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creep thing, and
th fowl of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.

6:8 but noah found grace in the eye of the lord.

6:9 these are the gener of noah: noah wa a just man and perfect
in hi generations, and noah walk with god.

6:10 and noah begat three sons, shem, ham, and japheth.

6:11 the earth also wa corrupt befor god, and the earth wa filled
with violence.

6:12 and god look upon the earth, and, behold, it wa corrupt; for
al flesh had corrupt hi way upon the earth.

6:13 and god said unto noah, the end of all flesh is come befor me;
for the earth is fill with violenc through them; and, behold, i
wil destroy them with the earth.

6:14 make thee an ark of gopher wood; room shalt thou make in the
ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

6:15 and thi is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: the length
of the ark shall be three hundr cubits, the breadth of it fifty
cubits, and the height of it thirti cubits.

6:16 A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou
finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side
thereof; with lower, second, and third stori shalt thou make it.

6:17 and, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of water upon the
earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under
heaven; and everi thing that is in the earth shall die.

6:18 but with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come
into the ark, thou, and thi sons, and thi wife, and thi sons' wives
with thee.

6:19 and of everi live thing of all flesh, two of everi sort shalt
thou bring into the ark, to keep them aliv with thee; they shall be
mal and female.

6:20 Of fowl after their kind, and of cattl after their kind, of
everi creep thing of the earth after hi kind, two of everi sort
shal come unto thee, to keep them alive.

6:21 and take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt
gath it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.

6:22 thu did noah; accord to all that god command him, so did
he.

7:1 and the lord said unto noah, come thou and all thi hous into the
ark; for thee have I seen righteou befor me in thi generation.

7:2 Of everi clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male
and hi female: and of beast that are not clean by two, the male and
hi female.

7:3 Of fowl also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to
keep seed aliv upon the face of all the earth.

7:4 for yet seven days, and I will caus it to rain upon the earth
forti day and forti nights; and everi live substanc that I have
mad will I destroy from off the face of the earth.

7:5 and noah did accord unto all that the lord command him.

7:6 and noah wa six hundr year old when the flood of water was
upon the earth.

7:7 and noah went in, and hi sons, and hi wife, and hi sons' wives
with him, into the ark, becaus of the water of the flood.

7:8 Of clean beasts, and of beast that are not clean, and of fowls,
and of everi thing that creepeth upon the earth, 7:9 there went in two
and two unto noah into the ark, the male and the female, as god had
command noah.

7:10 and it came to pass after seven days, that the water of the
flood were upon the earth.

7:11 In the six hundredth year of noah' life, in the second month,
th seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains
of the great deep broken up, and the window of heaven were opened.

7:12 and the rain wa upon the earth forti day and forti nights.

7:13 In the selfsam day enter noah, and shem, and ham, and japheth,
th son of noah, and noah' wife, and the three wive of hi sons
with them, into the ark; 7:14 they, and everi beast after hi kind,
and all the cattl after their kind, and everi creep thing that
creepeth upon the earth after hi kind, and everi fowl after hi kind,
everi bird of everi sort.

7:15 and they went in unto noah into the ark, two and two of all
flesh, wherein is the breath of life.

7:16 and they that went in, went in male and femal of all flesh, as
god had command him: and the lord shut him in.

7:17 and the flood wa forti day upon the earth; and the waters
increased, and bare up the ark, and it wa lift up abov the earth.

7:18 and the water prevailed, and were increas greatli upon the
earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

7:19 and the water prevail exceedingli upon the earth; and all the
high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.

7:20 fifteen cubit upward did the water prevail; and the mountains
wer covered.

7:21 and all flesh die that move upon the earth, both of fowl, and
of cattle, and of beast, and of everi creep thing that creepeth
upon the earth, and everi man: 7:22 all in whose nostril wa the
breath of life, of all that wa in the dri land, died.

7:23 and everi live substanc wa destroy which wa upon the face
of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creep things, and the
fowl of the heaven; and they were destroy from the earth: and noah
onli remain alive, and they that were with him in the ark.

7:24 and the water prevail upon the earth an hundr and fifty
days.

8:1 and god rememb noah, and everi live thing, and all the
cattl that wa with him in the ark: and god made a wind to pass over
th earth, and the water asswaged; 8:2 the fountain also of the deep
and the window of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was
restrained; 8:3 and the water return from off the earth
continually: and after the end of the hundr and fifti day the
wat were abated.

8:4 and the ark rest in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of
th month, upon the mountain of ararat.

8:5 and the water decreas continu until the tenth month: in the
tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the top of the
mountain seen.

8:6 and it came to pass at the end of forti days, that noah open the
window of the ark which he had made: 8:7 and he sent forth a raven,
which went forth to and fro, until the water were dri up from off
th earth.

8:8 also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the water were
ab from off the face of the ground; 8:9 but the dove found no rest
for the sole of her foot, and she return unto him into the ark, for
th water were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his
hand, and took her, and pull her in unto him into the ark.

8:10 and he stay yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the
dov out of the ark; 8:11 and the dove came in to him in the evening;
and, lo, in her mouth wa an oliv leaf pluckt off: so noah knew that
th water were abat from off the earth.

8:12 and he stay yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove;
which return not again unto him ani more.

8:13 and it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the
first month, the first day of the month, the water were dri up from
off the earth: and noah remov the cover of the ark, and looked,
and, behold, the face of the ground wa dry.

8:14 and in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the
month, wa the earth dried.

8:15 and god spake unto noah, saying, 8:16 Go forth of the ark, thou,
and thi wife, and thi sons, and thi sons' wive with thee.

8:17 bring forth with thee everi live thing that is with thee, of
al flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of everi creep thing
that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantli in the
earth, and be fruitful, and multipli upon the earth.

8:18 and noah went forth, and hi sons, and hi wife, and hi sons'
wiv with him: 8:19 everi beast, everi creep thing, and every
fowl, and whatsoev creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went
forth out of the ark.

8:20 and noah build an altar unto the lord; and took of everi clean
beast, and of everi clean fowl, and offer burnt offer on the
altar.

8:21 and the lord smell a sweet savour; and the lord said in his
heart, I will not again curs the ground ani more for man' sake; for
th imagin of man' heart is evil from hi youth; neither will i
again smite ani more everi thing living, as I have done.

8:22 while the earth remaineth, seedtim and harvest, and cold and
heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

9:1 and god bless noah and hi sons, and said unto them, be
fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

9:2 and the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon everi beast
of the earth, and upon everi fowl of the air, upon all that moveth
upon the earth, and upon all the fish of the sea; into your hand are
they delivered.

9:3 everi move thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the
green herb have I given you all things.

9:4 but flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall
y not eat.

9:5 and sure your blood of your live will I require; at the hand of
everi beast will I requir it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of
everi man' brother will I requir the life of man.

9:6 whoso sheddeth man' blood, by man shall hi blood be shed: for in
th imag of god made he man.

9:7 and you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantli in
th earth, and multipli therein.

9:8 and god spake unto noah, and to hi son with him, saying, 9:9 and
i, behold, I establish my coven with you, and with your seed after
you; 9:10 and with everi live creatur that is with you, of the
fowl, of the cattle, and of everi beast of the earth with you; from
al that go out of the ark, to everi beast of the earth.

9:11 and I will establish my coven with you, neither shall all
flesh be cut off ani more by the water of a flood; neither shall
ther ani more be a flood to destroy the earth.

9:12 and god said, thi is the token of the coven which I make
between me and you and everi live creatur that is with you, for
perpetu generations: 9:13 I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall
b for a token of a coven between me and the earth.

9:14 and it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth,
that the bow shall be seen in the cloud: 9:15 and I will rememb my
covenant, which is between me and you and everi live creatur of all
flesh; and the water shall no more becom a flood to destroy all
flesh.

9:16 and the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that
i may rememb the everlast coven between god and everi living
creatur of all flesh that is upon the earth.

9:17 and god said unto noah, thi is the token of the covenant, which
i have establish between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.

9:18 and the son of noah, that went forth of the ark, were shem, and
ham, and japheth: and ham is the father of canaan.

9:19 these are the three son of noah: and of them wa the whole earth
overspread.

9:20 and noah began to be an husbandman, and he plant a vineyard:
9:21 and he drank of the wine, and wa drunken; and he wa uncovered
within hi tent.

9:22 and ham, the father of canaan, saw the naked of hi father,
and told hi two brethren without.

9:23 and shem and japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their
shoulders, and went backward, and cover the naked of their
father; and their face were backward, and they saw not their father's
nakedness.

9:24 and noah awok from hi wine, and knew what hi younger son had
don unto him.

9:25 and he said, curs be canaan; a servant of servant shall he be
unto hi brethren.

9:26 and he said, bless be the lord god of shem; and canaan shall be
hi servant.

9:27 god shall enlarg japheth, and he shall dwell in the tent of
shem; and canaan shall be hi servant.

9:28 and noah live after the flood three hundr and fifti years.

9:29 and all the day of noah were nine hundr and fifti years: and
h died.

10:1 now these are the gener of the son of noah, shem, ham, and
japheth: and unto them were son born after the flood.

10:2 the son of japheth; gomer, and magog, and madai, and javan, and
tubal, and meshech, and tiras.

10:3 and the son of gomer; ashkenaz, and riphath, and togarmah.

10:4 and the son of javan; elishah, and tarshish, kittim, and
dodanim.

10:5 By these were the isl of the gentil divid in their lands;
everi one after hi tongue, after their families, in their nations.

10:6 and the son of ham; cush, and mizraim, and phut, and canaan.

10:7 and the son of cush; seba, and havilah, and sabtah, and raamah,
and sabtechah: and the son of raamah; sheba, and dedan.

10:8 and cush begat nimrod: he began to be a mighti one in the earth.

10:9 He wa a mighti hunter befor the lord: wherefor it is said,
even as nimrod the mighti hunter befor the lord.

10:10 and the begin of hi kingdom wa babel, and erech, and
accad, and calneh, in the land of shinar.

10:11 out of that land went forth asshur, and build nineveh, and the
citi rehoboth, and calah, 10:12 and resen between nineveh and calah:
th same is a great city.

10:13 and mizraim begat ludim, and anamim, and lehabim, and naphtuhim,
10:14 and pathrusim, and casluhim, (out of whom came philistim,) and
caphtorim.

10:15 and canaan begat sidon hi first born, and heth, 10:16 and the
jebusite, and the amorite, and the girgasite, 10:17 and the hivite,
and the arkite, and the sinite, 10:18 and the arvadite, and the
zemarite, and the hamathite: and afterward were the famili of the
canaanit spread abroad.

10:19 and the border of the canaanit wa from sidon, as thou comest
to gerar, unto gaza; as thou goest, unto sodom, and gomorrah, and
admah, and zeboim, even unto lasha.

10:20 these are the son of ham, after their families, after their
tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.

10:21 unto shem also, the father of all the children of eber, the
broth of japheth the elder, even to him were children born.

10:22 the children of shem; elam, and asshur, and arphaxad, and lud,
and aram.

10:23 and the children of aram; uz, and hul, and gether, and mash.

10:24 and arphaxad begat salah; and salah begat eber.

10:25 and unto eber were born two sons: the name of one wa peleg; for
in hi day wa the earth divided; and hi brother' name wa joktan.

10:26 and joktan begat almodad, and sheleph, and hazarmaveth, and
jerah, 10:27 and hadoram, and uzal, and diklah, 10:28 and obal, and
abimael, and sheba, 10:29 and ophir, and havilah, and jobab: all these
wer the son of joktan.

10:30 and their dwell wa from mesha, as thou goest unto sephar a
mount of the east.

10:31 these are the son of shem, after their families, after their
tongues, in their lands, after their nations.

10:32 these are the famili of the son of noah, after their
generations, in their nations: and by these were the nation divided
in the earth after the flood.

11:1 and the whole earth wa of one language, and of one speech.

11:2 and it came to pass, as they journey from the east, that they
found a plain in the land of shinar; and they dwelt there.

11:3 and they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn
them thoroughly. and they had brick for stone, and slime had they for
morter.

11:4 and they said, Go to, let us build us a citi and a tower, whose
top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be
scatt abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

11:5 and the lord came down to see the citi and the tower, which the
children of men builded.

11:6 and the lord said, behold, the peopl is one, and they have all
on language; and thi they begin to do: and now noth will be
restrain from them, which they have imagin to do.

11:7 Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that
they may not understand one another' speech.

11:8 So the lord scatter them abroad from thenc upon the face of
al the earth: and they left off to build the city.

11:9 therefor is the name of it call babel; becaus the lord did
ther confound the languag of all the earth: and from thenc did the
lord scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

11:10 these are the gener of shem: shem wa an hundr years
old, and begat arphaxad two year after the flood: 11:11 and shem
liv after he begat arphaxad five hundr years, and begat son and
daughters.

11:12 and arphaxad live five and thirti years, and begat salah: 11:13
and arphaxad live after he begat salah four hundr and three years,
and begat son and daughters.

11:14 and salah live thirti years, and begat eber: 11:15 and salah
liv after he begat eber four hundr and three years, and begat sons
and daughters.

11:16 and eber live four and thirti years, and begat peleg: 11:17 and
eb live after he begat peleg four hundr and thirti years, and
begat son and daughters.

11:18 and peleg live thirti years, and begat reu: 11:19 and peleg
liv after he begat reu two hundr and nine years, and begat sons
and daughters.

11:20 and reu live two and thirti years, and begat serug: 11:21 and
reu live after he begat serug two hundr and seven years, and begat
son and daughters.

11:22 and serug live thirti years, and begat nahor: 11:23 and serug
liv after he begat nahor two hundr years, and begat son and
daughters.

11:24 and nahor live nine and twenti years, and begat terah: 11:25
and nahor live after he begat terah an hundr and nineteen years,
and begat son and daughters.

11:26 and terah live seventi years, and begat abram, nahor, and
haran.

11:27 now these are the gener of terah: terah begat abram,
nahor, and haran; and haran begat lot.

11:28 and haran die befor hi father terah in the land of his
nativity, in Ur of the chaldees.

11:29 and abram and nahor took them wives: the name of abram' wife
wa sarai; and the name of nahor' wife, milcah, the daughter of
haran, the father of milcah, and the father of iscah.

11:30 but sarai wa barren; she had no child.

11:31 and terah took abram hi son, and lot the son of haran hi son's
son, and sarai hi daughter in law, hi son abram' wife; and they
went forth with them from Ur of the chaldees, to go into the land of
canaan; and they came unto haran, and dwelt there.

11:32 and the day of terah were two hundr and five years: and terah
di in haran.

12:1 now the lord had said unto abram, get thee out of thi country,
and from thi kindred, and from thi father' house, unto a land that i
wil shew thee: 12:2 and I will make of thee a great nation, and i
wil bless thee, and make thi name great; and thou shalt be a
blessing: 12:3 and I will bless them that bless thee, and curs him
that curseth thee: and in thee shall all famili of the earth be
blessed.

12:4 So abram departed, as the lord had spoken unto him; and lot went
with him: and abram wa seventi and five year old when he departed
out of haran.

12:5 and abram took sarai hi wife, and lot hi brother' son, and all
their substanc that they had gathered, and the soul that they had
gotten in haran; and they went forth to go into the land of canaan;
and into the land of canaan they came.

12:6 and abram pass through the land unto the place of sichem, unto
th plain of moreh. and the canaanit wa then in the land.

12:7 and the lord appear unto abram, and said, unto thi seed will i
giv thi land: and there build he an altar unto the lord, who
appear unto him.

12:8 and he remov from thenc unto a mountain on the east of bethel,
and pitch hi tent, have bethel on the west, and hai on the east:
and there he build an altar unto the lord, and call upon the name
of the lord.

12:9 and abram journeyed, go on still toward the south.

12:10 and there wa a famin in the land: and abram went down into
egypt to sojourn there; for the famin wa grievou in the land.

12:11 and it came to pass, when he wa come near to enter into egypt,
that he said unto sarai hi wife, behold now, I know that thou art a
fair woman to look upon: 12:12 therefor it shall come to pass, when
th egyptian shall see thee, that they shall say, thi is hi wife:
and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.

12:13 say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with
m for thi sake; and my soul shall live becaus of thee.

12:14 and it came to pass, that, when abram wa come into egypt, the
egyptian beheld the woman that she wa veri fair.

12:15 the princ also of pharaoh saw her, and commend her before
pharaoh: and the woman wa taken into pharaoh' house.

12:16 and he entreat abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and
oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses,
and camels.

12:17 and the lord plagu pharaoh and hi hous with great plagues
becaus of sarai abram' wife.

12:18 and pharaoh call abram and said, what is thi that thou hast
don unto me? whi didst thou not tell me that she wa thi wife?  12:19
whi saidst thou, she is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to
wife: now therefor behold thi wife, take her, and go thi way.

12:20 and pharaoh command hi men concern him: and they sent him
away, and hi wife, and all that he had.

13:1 and abram went up out of egypt, he, and hi wife, and all that he
had, and lot with him, into the south.

13:2 and abram wa veri rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.

13:3 and he went on hi journey from the south even to bethel, unto
th place where hi tent had been at the beginning, between bethel and
hai; 13:4 unto the place of the altar, which he had make there at the
first: and there abram call on the name of the lord.

13:5 and lot also, which went with abram, had flocks, and herds, and
tents.

13:6 and the land wa not abl to bear them, that they might dwell
together: for their substanc wa great, so that they could not dwell
together.

13:7 and there wa a strife between the herdmen of abram' cattl and
th herdmen of lot' cattle: and the canaanit and the perizzite
dwel then in the land.

13:8 and abram said unto lot, let there be no strife, I pray thee,
between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thi herdmen; for we be
brethren.

13:9 Is not the whole land befor thee? separ thyself, I pray thee,
from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right;
or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

13:10 and lot lift up hi eyes, and beheld all the plain of jordan,
that it wa well water everi where, befor the lord destroy sodom
and gomorrah, even as the garden of the lord, like the land of egypt,
a thou comest unto zoar.

13:11 then lot chose him all the plain of jordan; and lot journeyed
east: and they separ themselv the one from the other.

13:12 abram dwell in the land of canaan, and lot dwell in the
citi of the plain, and pitch hi tent toward sodom.

13:13 but the men of sodom were wick and sinner befor the lord
exceedingly.

13:14 and the lord said unto abram, after that lot wa separ from
him, lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art
northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward: 13:15 for all
th land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thi seed for
ever.

13:16 and I will make thi seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a
man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thi seed also be
numbered.

13:17 arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the
breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.

13:18 then abram remov hi tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of
mamre, which is in hebron, and built there an altar unto the lord.

14:1 and it came to pass in the day of amraphel king of shinar,
arioch king of ellasar, chedorlaom king of elam, and tidal king of
nations; 14:2 that these made war with bera king of sodom, and with
birsha king of gomorrah, shinab king of admah, and shemeb king of
zeboiim, and the king of bela, which is zoar.

14:3 all these were join togeth in the vale of siddim, which is
th salt sea.

14:4 twelv year they serv chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year
they rebelled.

14:5 and in the fourteenth year came chedorlaomer, and the king that
wer with him, and smote the rephaim in ashteroth karnaim, and the
zuzim in ham, and the emin in shaveh kiriathaim, 14:6 and the
horit in their mount seir, unto elparan, which is by the wilderness.

14:7 and they returned, and came to enmishpat, which is kadesh, and
smot all the countri of the amalekites, and also the amorites, that
dwelt in hazezontamar.

14:8 and there went out the king of sodom, and the king of gomorrah,
and the king of admah, and the king of zeboiim, and the king of bela
(th same is zoar;) and they join battl with them in the vale of
siddim; 14:9 with chedorlaom the king of elam, and with tidal king
of nations, and amraphel king of shinar, and arioch king of ellasar;
four king with five.

14:10 and the vale of siddim wa full of slimepits; and the king of
sodom and gomorrah fled, and fell there; and they that remain fled
to the mountain.

14:11 and they took all the good of sodom and gomorrah, and all their
victuals, and went their way.

14:12 and they took lot, abram' brother' son, who dwelt in sodom,
and hi goods, and departed.

14:13 and there came one that had escaped, and told abram the hebrew;
for he dwelt in the plain of mamr the amorite, brother of eshcol, and
broth of aner: and these were confeder with abram.

14:14 and when abram heard that hi brother wa taken captive, he
arm hi train servants, born in hi own house, three hundr and
eighteen, and pursu them unto dan.

14:15 and he divid himself against them, he and hi servants, by
night, and smote them, and pursu them unto hobah, which is on the
left hand of damascus.

14:16 and he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his
broth lot, and hi goods, and the women also, and the people.

14:17 and the king of sodom went out to meet him after hi return from
th slaughter of chedorlaomer, and of the king that were with him, at
th valley of shaveh, which is the king' dale.

14:18 and melchizedek king of salem brought forth bread and wine: and
h wa the priest of the most high god.

14:19 and he bless him, and said, bless be abram of the most high
god, possessor of heaven and earth: 14:20 and bless be the most high
god, which hath deliv thine enemi into thi hand. and he gave him
tith of all.

14:21 and the king of sodom said unto abram, give me the persons, and
tak the good to thyself.

14:22 and abram said to the king of sodom, I have lift up mine hand
unto the lord, the most high god, the possessor of heaven and earth,
14:23 that I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and
that I will not take ani thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say,
i have made abram rich: 14:24 save onli that which the young men have
eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, aner, eshcol,
and mamre; let them take their portion.

15:1 after these thing the word of the lord came unto abram in a
vision, saying, fear not, abram: I am thi shield, and thi exceeding
great reward.

15:2 and abram said, lord god, what wilt thou give me, see I go
childless, and the steward of my hous is thi eliez of damascus?
15:3 and abram said, behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo,
on born in my hous is mine heir.

15:4 and, behold, the word of the lord came unto him, saying, this
shal not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own
bowel shall be thine heir.

15:5 and he brought him forth abroad, and said, look now toward
heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be abl to number them: and he
said unto him, So shall thi seed be.

15:6 and he believ in the lord; and he count it to him for
righteousness.

15:7 and he said unto him, I am the lord that brought thee out of ur
of the chaldees, to give thee thi land to inherit it.

15:8 and he said, lord god, wherebi shall I know that I shall inherit
it?  15:9 and he said unto him, take me an heifer of three year old,
and a she goat of three year old, and a ram of three year old, and a
turtledove, and a young pigeon.

15:10 and he took unto him all these, and divid them in the midst,
and laid each piec one against another: but the bird divid he not.

15:11 and when the fowl came down upon the carcases, abram drove them
away.

15:12 and when the sun wa go down, a deep sleep fell upon abram;
and, lo, an horror of great dark fell upon him.

15:13 and he said unto abram, know of a sureti that thi seed shall be
a stranger in a land that is not their's, and shall serv them; and
they shall afflict them four hundr years; 15:14 and also that
nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they
com out with great substance.

15:15 and thou shalt go to thi father in peace; thou shalt be buried
in a good old age.

15:16 but in the fourth gener they shall come hither again: for
th iniqu of the amorit is not yet full.

15:17 and it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was
dark, behold a smoke furnace, and a burn lamp that pass between
thos pieces.

15:18 In the same day the lord made a coven with abram, saying,
unto thi seed have I given thi land, from the river of egypt unto the
great river, the river euphrates: 15:19 the kenites, and the
kenizzites, and the kadmonites, 15:20 and the hittites, and the
perizzites, and the rephaims, 15:21 and the amorites, and the
canaanites, and the girgashites, and the jebusites.

16:1 now sarai abram' wife bare him no children: and she had an
handmaid, an egyptian, whose name wa hagar.

16:2 and sarai said unto abram, behold now, the lord hath restrained
m from bearing: I pray thee, go in unto my maid; it may be that I may
obtain children by her. and abram hearken to the voic of sarai.

16:3 and sarai abram' wife took hagar her maid the egyptian, after
abram had dwelt ten year in the land of canaan, and gave her to her
husband abram to be hi wife.

16:4 and he went in unto hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw
that she had conceived, her mistress wa despis in her eyes.

16:5 and sarai said unto abram, My wrong be upon thee: I have given my
maid into thi bosom; and when she saw that she had conceived, I was
despis in her eyes: the lord judg between me and thee.

16:6 but abram said unto sarai, behold, thi maid is in thine hand; do
to her as it pleaseth thee. and when sarai dealt hardli with her, she
fl from her face.

16:7 and the angel of the lord found her by a fountain of water in the
wilderness, by the fountain in the way to shur.

16:8 and he said, hagar, sarai' maid, whenc camest thou? and whither
wilt thou go? and she said, I flee from the face of my mistress sarai.

16:9 and the angel of the lord said unto her, return to thi mistress,
and submit thyself under her hands.

16:10 and the angel of the lord said unto her, I will multipli thy
se exceedingly, that it shall not be number for multitude.

16:11 and the angel of the lord said unto her, behold, thou art with
child and shalt bear a son, and shalt call hi name ishmael; because
th lord hath heard thi affliction.

16:12 and he will be a wild man; hi hand will be against everi man,
and everi man' hand against him; and he shall dwell in the presence
of all hi brethren.

16:13 and she call the name of the lord that spake unto her, thou
god seest me: for she said, have I also here look after him that
seeth me?  16:14 wherefor the well wa call beerlahairoi; behold,
it is between kadesh and bered.

16:15 and hagar bare abram a son: and abram call hi son' name,
which hagar bare, ishmael.

16:16 and abram wa fourscor and six year old, when hagar bare
ishmael to abram.

17:1 and when abram wa nineti year old and nine, the lord appeared
to abram, and said unto him, I am the almighti god; walk befor me,
and be thou perfect.

17:2 and I will make my coven between me and thee, and will
multipli thee exceedingly.

17:3 and abram fell on hi face: and god talk with him, saying, 17:4
a for me, behold, my coven is with thee, and thou shalt be a
fath of mani nations.

17:5 neither shall thi name ani more be call abram, but thi name
shal be abraham; for a father of mani nation have I made thee.

17:6 and I will make thee exceed fruitful, and I will make nations
of thee, and king shall come out of thee.

17:7 and I will establish my coven between me and thee and thi seed
aft thee in their gener for an everlast covenant, to be a
god unto thee, and to thi seed after thee.

17:8 and I will give unto thee, and to thi seed after thee, the land
wherein thou art a stranger, all the land of canaan, for an
everlast possession; and I will be their god.

17:9 and god said unto abraham, thou shalt keep my coven therefore,
thou, and thi seed after thee in their generations.

17:10 thi is my covenant, which ye shall keep, between me and you and
thi seed after thee; everi man child among you shall be circumcised.

17:11 and ye shall circumcis the flesh of your foreskin; and it shall
b a token of the coven betwixt me and you.

17:12 and he that is eight day old shall be circumcis among you,
everi man child in your generations, he that is born in the house, or
bought with money of ani stranger, which is not of thi seed.

17:13 He that is born in thi house, and he that is bought with thy
money, must need be circumcised: and my coven shall be in your
flesh for an everlast covenant.

17:14 and the uncircumcis man child whose flesh of hi foreskin is
not circumcised, that soul shall be cut off from hi people; he hath
broken my covenant.

17:15 and god said unto abraham, As for sarai thi wife, thou shalt not
cal her name sarai, but sarah shall her name be.

17:16 and I will bless her, and give thee a son also of her: yea, i
wil bless her, and she shall be a mother of nations; king of people
shal be of her.

17:17 then abraham fell upon hi face, and laughed, and said in his
heart, shall a child be born unto him that is an hundr year old?
and shall sarah, that is nineti year old, bear?  17:18 and abraham
said unto god, O that ishmael might live befor thee!  17:19 and god
said, sarah thi wife shall bear thee a son indeed; and thou shalt call
hi name isaac: and I will establish my coven with him for an
everlast covenant, and with hi seed after him.

17:20 and as for ishmael, I have heard thee: behold, I have blessed
him, and will make him fruitful, and will multipli him exceedingly;
twelv princ shall he beget, and I will make him a great nation.

17:21 but my coven will I establish with isaac, which sarah shall
bear unto thee at thi set time in the next year.

17:22 and he left off talk with him, and god went up from abraham.

17:23 and abraham took ishmael hi son, and all that were born in his
house, and all that were bought with hi money, everi male among the
men of abraham' house; and circumcis the flesh of their foreskin in
th selfsam day, as god had said unto him.

17:24 and abraham wa nineti year old and nine, when he was
circumcis in the flesh of hi foreskin.

17:25 and ishmael hi son wa thirteen year old, when he was
circumcis in the flesh of hi foreskin.

17:26 In the selfsam day wa abraham circumcised, and ishmael his
son.

17:27 and all the men of hi house, born in the house, and bought with
money of the stranger, were circumcis with him.

18:1 and the lord appear unto him in the plain of mamre: and he sat
in the tent door in the heat of the day; 18:2 and he lift up hi eyes
and looked, and, lo, three men stood by him: and when he saw them, he
ran to meet them from the tent door, and bow himself toward the
ground, 18:3 and said, My lord, if now I have found favour in thy
sight, pass not away, I pray thee, from thi servant: 18:4 let a little
water, I pray you, be fetched, and wash your feet, and rest yourselves
und the tree: 18:5 and I will fetch a morsel of bread, and comfort
y your hearts; after that ye shall pass on: for therefor are ye come
to your servant. and they said, So do, as thou hast said.

18:6 and abraham hasten into the tent unto sarah, and said, make
readi quickli three measur of fine meal, knead it, and make cakes
upon the hearth.

18:7 and abraham ran unto the herd, and fetcht a calf tender and good,
and gave it unto a young man; and he hast to dress it.

18:8 and he took butter, and milk, and the calf which he had dressed,
and set it befor them; and he stood by them under the tree, and they
did eat.

18:9 and they said unto him, where is sarah thi wife? and he said,
behold, in the tent.

18:10 and he said, I will certainli return unto thee accord to the
tim of life; and, lo, sarah thi wife shall have a son. and sarah
heard it in the tent door, which wa behind him.

18:11 now abraham and sarah were old and well stricken in age; and it
ceas to be with sarah after the manner of women.

18:12 therefor sarah laugh within herself, saying, after I am waxed
old shall I have pleasure, my lord be old also?  18:13 and the lord
said unto abraham, wherefor did sarah laugh, saying, shall I of a
sureti bear a child, which am old?  18:14 Is ani thing too hard for
th lord? At the time appoint I will return unto thee, accord to
th time of life, and sarah shall have a son.

18:15 then sarah denied, saying, I laugh not; for she wa afraid.
and he said, nay; but thou didst laugh.

18:16 and the men rose up from thence, and look toward sodom: and
abraham went with them to bring them on the way.

18:17 and the lord said, shall I hide from abraham that thing which i
do; 18:18 see that abraham shall sure becom a great and mighty
nation, and all the nation of the earth shall be bless in him?
18:19 for I know him, that he will command hi children and his
household after him, and they shall keep the way of the lord, to do
justic and judgment; that the lord may bring upon abraham that which
h hath spoken of him.

18:20 and the lord said, becaus the cri of sodom and gomorrah is
great, and becaus their sin is veri grievous; 18:21 I will go down
now, and see whether they have done altogeth accord to the cri of
it, which is come unto me; and if not, I will know.

18:22 and the men turn their face from thence, and went toward
sodom: but abraham stood yet befor the lord.

18:23 and abraham drew near, and said, wilt thou also destroy the
right with the wicked?  18:24 peradventur there be fifty
right within the city: wilt thou also destroy and not spare the
plac for the fifti righteou that are therein?  18:25 that be far
from thee to do after thi manner, to slay the righteou with the
wicked: and that the righteou should be as the wicked, that be far
from thee: shall not the judg of all the earth do right?  18:26 and
th lord said, If I find in sodom fifti righteou within the city,
then I will spare all the place for their sakes.

18:27 and abraham answer and said, behold now, I have taken upon me
to speak unto the lord, which am but dust and ashes: 18:28
peradventur there shall lack five of the fifti righteous: wilt thou
destroy all the citi for lack of five? and he said, If I find there
forti and five, I will not destroy it.

18:29 and he spake unto him yet again, and said, peradventur there
shal be forti found there. and he said, I will not do it for forty's
sake.

18:30 and he said unto him, Oh let not the lord be angry, and I will
speak: peradventur there shall thirti be found there. and he said, i
wil not do it, if I find thirti there.

18:31 and he said, behold now, I have taken upon me to speak unto the
lord: peradventur there shall be twenti found there. and he said, i
wil not destroy it for twenty' sake.

18:32 and he said, Oh let not the lord be angry, and I will speak yet
but thi once: peradventur ten shall be found there. and he said, i
wil not destroy it for ten' sake.

18:33 and the lord went hi way, as soon as he had left commun with
abraham: and abraham return unto hi place.

19:1 and there came two angel to sodom at even; and lot sat in the
gat of sodom: and lot see them rose up to meet them; and he bowed
himself with hi face toward the ground; 19:2 and he said, behold now,
mi lords, turn in, I pray you, into your servant' house, and tarry
al night, and wash your feet, and ye shall rise up early, and go on
your ways. and they said, nay; but we will abid in the street all
night.

19:3 and he press upon them greatly; and they turn in unto him,
and enter into hi house; and he made them a feast, and did bake
unleaven bread, and they did eat.

19:4 but befor they lay down, the men of the city, even the men of
sodom, compass the hous round, both old and young, all the people
from everi quarter: 19:5 and they call unto lot, and said unto him,
wher are the men which came in to thee thi night? bring them out
unto us, that we may know them.

19:6 and lot went out at the door unto them, and shut the door after
him, 19:7 and said, I pray you, brethren, do not so wickedly.

19:8 behold now, I have two daughter which have not known man; let
me, I pray you, bring them out unto you, and do ye to them as is good
in your eyes: onli unto these men do nothing; for therefor came they
und the shadow of my roof.

19:9 and they said, stand back. and they said again, thi one fellow
cam in to sojourn, and he will need be a judge: now will we deal
wors with thee, than with them. and they press sore upon the man,
even lot, and came near to break the door.

19:10 but the men put forth their hand, and pull lot into the house
to them, and shut to the door.

19:11 and they smote the men that were at the door of the hous with
blindness, both small and great: so that they weari themselv to
find the door.

19:12 and the men said unto lot, hast thou here ani besides? son in
law, and thi sons, and thi daughters, and whatsoev thou hast in the
city, bring them out of thi place: 19:13 for we will destroy this
place, becaus the cri of them is waxen great befor the face of the
lord; and the lord hath sent us to destroy it.

19:14 and lot went out, and spake unto hi son in law, which married
hi daughters, and said, up, get you out of thi place; for the lord
wil destroy thi city. but he seem as one that mock unto hi sons
in law.

19:15 and when the morn arose, then the angel hasten lot,
saying, arise, take thi wife, and thi two daughters, which are here;
lest thou be consum in the iniqu of the city.

19:16 and while he lingered, the men laid hold upon hi hand, and upon
th hand of hi wife, and upon the hand of hi two daughters; the lord
b merci unto him: and they brought him forth, and set him
without the city.

19:17 and it came to pass, when they had brought them forth abroad,
that he said, escap for thi life; look not behind thee, neither stay
thou in all the plain; escap to the mountain, lest thou be consumed.

19:18 and lot said unto them, oh, not so, my lord: 19:19 behold now,
thi servant hath found grace in thi sight, and thou hast magnifi thy
mercy, which thou hast shew unto me in save my life; and I cannot
escap to the mountain, lest some evil take me, and I die: 19:20
behold now, thi citi is near to flee unto, and it is a littl one:
oh, let me escap thither, (i it not a littl one?) and my soul shall
live.

19:21 and he said unto him, see, I have accept thee concern this
th also, that I will not overthrow thi city, for the which thou
hast spoken.

19:22 hast thee, escap thither; for I cannot do anyth till thou
b come thither. therefor the name of the citi wa call zoar.

19:23 the sun wa risen upon the earth when lot enter into zoar.

19:24 then the lord rain upon sodom and upon gomorrah brimston and
fir from the lord out of heaven; 19:25 and he overthrew those cities,
and all the plain, and all the inhabit of the cities, and that
which grew upon the ground.

19:26 but hi wife look back from behind him, and she becam a
pillar of salt.

19:27 and abraham gat up earli in the morn to the place where he
stood befor the lord: 19:28 and he look toward sodom and gomorrah,
and toward all the land of the plain, and beheld, and, lo, the smoke
of the countri went up as the smoke of a furnace.

19:29 and it came to pass, when god destroy the citi of the plain,
that god rememb abraham, and sent lot out of the midst of the
overthrow, when he overthrew the citi in the which lot dwelt.

19:30 and lot went up out of zoar, and dwelt in the mountain, and his
two daughter with him; for he fear to dwell in zoar: and he dwelt
in a cave, he and hi two daughters.

19:31 and the firstborn said unto the younger, our father is old, and
ther is not a man in the earth to come in unto us after the manner of
al the earth: 19:32 come, let us make our father drink wine, and we
wil lie with him, that we may preserv seed of our father.

19:33 and they made their father drink wine that night: and the
firstborn went in, and lay with her father; and he perceiv not when
sh lay down, nor when she arose.

19:34 and it came to pass on the morrow, that the firstborn said unto
th younger, behold, I lay yesternight with my father: let us make him
drink wine thi night also; and go thou in, and lie with him, that we
may preserv seed of our father.

19:35 and they made their father drink wine that night also: and the
young arose, and lay with him; and he perceiv not when she lay
down, nor when she arose.

19:36 thu were both the daughter of lot with child by their father.

19:37 and the first born bare a son, and call hi name moab: the
sam is the father of the moabit unto thi day.

19:38 and the younger, she also bare a son, and call hi name
benammi: the same is the father of the children of ammon unto this
day.

20:1 and abraham journey from thenc toward the south country, and
dwel between kadesh and shur, and sojourn in gerar.

20:2 and abraham said of sarah hi wife, she is my sister: and
abimelech king of gerar sent, and took sarah.

20:3 but god came to abimelech in a dream by night, and said to him,
behold, thou art but a dead man, for the woman which thou hast taken;
for she is a man' wife.

20:4 but abimelech had not come near her: and he said, lord, wilt thou
slay also a righteou nation?  20:5 said he not unto me, she is my
sister? and she, even she herself said, He is my brother: in the
integr of my heart and innoc of my hand have I done this.

20:6 and god said unto him in a dream, yea, I know that thou didst
thi in the integr of thi heart; for I also withheld thee from
sin against me: therefor suffer I thee not to touch her.

20:7 now therefor restor the man hi wife; for he is a prophet, and
h shall pray for thee, and thou shalt live: and if thou restor her
not, know thou that thou shalt sure die, thou, and all that are
thine.

20:8 therefor abimelech rose earli in the morning, and call all his
servants, and told all these thing in their ears: and the men were
sor afraid.

20:9 then abimelech call abraham, and said unto him, what hast thou
don unto us? and what have I offend thee, that thou hast brought on
m and on my kingdom a great sin? thou hast done deed unto me that
ought not to be done.

20:10 and abimelech said unto abraham, what sawest thou, that thou
hast done thi thing?  20:11 and abraham said, becaus I thought,
sur the fear of god is not in thi place; and they will slay me for
mi wife' sake.

20:12 and yet inde she is my sister; she is the daughter of my
father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she becam my wife.

20:13 and it came to pass, when god caus me to wander from my
father' house, that I said unto her, thi is thi kind which thou
shalt shew unto me; at everi place whither we shall come, say of me,
h is my brother.

20:14 and abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and
womenservants, and gave them unto abraham, and restor him sarah his
wife.

20:15 and abimelech said, behold, my land is befor thee: dwell where
it pleaseth thee.

20:16 and unto sarah he said, behold, I have given thi brother a
thousand piec of silver: behold, he is to thee a cover of the
eyes, unto all that are with thee, and with all other: thu she was
reproved.

20:17 So abraham pray unto god: and god heal abimelech, and his
wife, and hi maidservants; and they bare children.

20:18 for the lord had fast close up all the womb of the hous of
abimelech, becaus of sarah abraham' wife.

21:1 and the lord visit sarah as he had said, and the lord did unto
sarah as he had spoken.

21:2 for sarah conceived, and bare abraham a son in hi old age, at
th set time of which god had spoken to him.

21:3 and abraham call the name of hi son that wa born unto him,
whom sarah bare to him, isaac.

21:4 and abraham circumcis hi son isaac be eight day old, as
god had command him.

21:5 and abraham wa an hundr year old, when hi son isaac wa born
unto him.

21:6 and sarah said, god hath made me to laugh, so that all that hear
wil laugh with me.

21:7 and she said, who would have said unto abraham, that sarah should
hav given children suck? for I have born him a son in hi old age.

21:8 and the child grew, and wa weaned: and abraham made a great
feast the same day that isaac wa weaned.

21:9 and sarah saw the son of hagar the egyptian, which she had born
unto abraham, mocking.

21:10 wherefor she said unto abraham, cast out thi bondwoman and her
son: for the son of thi bondwoman shall not be heir with my son, even
with isaac.

21:11 and the thing wa veri grievou in abraham' sight becaus of
hi son.

21:12 and god said unto abraham, let it not be grievou in thi sight
becaus of the lad, and becaus of thi bondwoman; in all that sarah
hath said unto thee, hearken unto her voice; for in isaac shall thy
se be called.

21:13 and also of the son of the bondwoman will I make a nation,
becaus he is thi seed.

21:14 and abraham rose up earli in the morning, and took bread, and a
bottl of water, and gave it unto hagar, put it on her shoulder,
and the child, and sent her away: and she departed, and wander in
th wilder of beersheba.

21:15 and the water wa spent in the bottle, and she cast the child
und one of the shrubs.

21:16 and she went, and sat her down over against him a good way off,
a it were a bow shot: for she said, let me not see the death of the
child. and she sat over against him, and lift up her voice, and wept.

21:17 and god heard the voic of the lad; and the angel of god called
to hagar out of heaven, and said unto her, what aileth thee, hagar?
fear not; for god hath heard the voic of the lad where he is.

21:18 arise, lift up the lad, and hold him in thine hand; for I will
mak him a great nation.

21:19 and god open her eyes, and she saw a well of water; and she
went, and fill the bottl with water, and gave the lad drink.

21:20 and god wa with the lad; and he grew, and dwelt in the
wilderness, and becam an archer.

21:21 and he dwelt in the wilder of paran: and hi mother took him
a wife out of the land of egypt.

21:22 and it came to pass at that time, that abimelech and phichol the
chief captain of hi host spake unto abraham, saying, god is with thee
in all that thou doest: 21:23 now therefor swear unto me here by god
that thou wilt not deal fals with me, nor with my son, nor with my
son' son: but accord to the kind that I have done unto thee,
thou shalt do unto me, and to the land wherein thou hast sojourned.

21:24 and abraham said, I will swear.

21:25 and abraham reprov abimelech becaus of a well of water, which
abimelech' servant had violent taken away.

21:26 and abimelech said, I wot not who hath done thi thing; neither
didst thou tell me, neither yet heard I of it, but to day.

21:27 and abraham took sheep and oxen, and gave them unto abimelech;
and both of them made a covenant.

21:28 and abraham set seven ewe lamb of the flock by themselves.

21:29 and abimelech said unto abraham, what mean these seven ewe lambs
which thou hast set by themselves?  21:30 and he said, for these seven
ew lamb shalt thou take of my hand, that they may be a wit unto
me, that I have dig thi well.

21:31 wherefor he call that place beersheba; becaus there they
swar both of them.

21:32 thu they made a coven at beersheba: then abimelech rose up,
and phichol the chief captain of hi host, and they return into the
land of the philistines.

21:33 and abraham plant a grove in beersheba, and call there on
th name of the lord, the everlast god.

21:34 and abraham sojourn in the philistines' land mani days.

22:1 and it came to pass after these things, that god did tempt
abraham, and said unto him, abraham: and he said, behold, here I am.

22:2 and he said, take now thi son, thine onli son isaac, whom thou
lovest, and get thee into the land of moriah; and offer him there for
a burnt offer upon one of the mountain which I will tell thee of.

22:3 and abraham rose up earli in the morning, and saddl hi ass,
and took two of hi young men with him, and isaac hi son, and clave
th wood for the burnt offering, and rose up, and went unto the place
of which god had told him.

22:4 then on the third day abraham lift up hi eyes, and saw the
plac afar off.

22:5 and abraham said unto hi young men, abid ye here with the ass;
and I and the lad will go yonder and worship, and come again to you.

22:6 and abraham took the wood of the burnt offering, and laid it upon
isaac hi son; and he took the fire in hi hand, and a knife; and they
went both of them together.

22:7 and isaac spake unto abraham hi father, and said, My father: and
h said, here am I, my son. and he said, behold the fire and the wood:
but where is the lamb for a burnt offering?  22:8 and abraham said, my
son, god will provid himself a lamb for a burnt offering: so they
went both of them together.

22:9 and they came to the place which god had told him of; and abraham
built an altar there, and laid the wood in order, and bound isaac his
son, and laid him on the altar upon the wood.

22:10 and abraham stretch forth hi hand, and took the knife to slay
hi son.

22:11 and the angel of the lord call unto him out of heaven, and
said, abraham, abraham: and he said, here am i.

22:12 and he said, lay not thine hand upon the lad, neither do thou
ani thing unto him: for now I know that thou fearest god, see thou
hast not withheld thi son, thine onli son from me.

22:13 and abraham lift up hi eyes, and looked, and behold behind
him a ram caught in a thicket by hi horns: and abraham went and took
th ram, and offer him up for a burnt offer in the stead of his
son.

22:14 and abraham call the name of that place jehovahjireh: as it is
said to thi day, In the mount of the lord it shall be seen.

22:15 and the angel of the lord call unto abraham out of heaven the
second time, 22:16 and said, By myself have I sworn, saith the lord,
for becaus thou hast done thi thing, and hast not withheld thi son,
thin onli son: 22:17 that in bless I will bless thee, and in
multipli I will multipli thi seed as the star of the heaven, and
a the sand which is upon the sea shore; and thi seed shall possess
th gate of hi enemies; 22:18 and in thi seed shall all the nations
of the earth be blessed; becaus thou hast obey my voice.

22:19 So abraham return unto hi young men, and they rose up and
went togeth to beersheba; and abraham dwelt at beersheba.

22:20 and it came to pass after these things, that it wa told
abraham, saying, behold, milcah, she hath also born children unto thy
broth nahor; 22:21 huz hi firstborn, and buz hi brother, and
kemuel the father of aram, 22:22 and chesed, and hazo, and pildash,
and jidlaph, and bethuel.

22:23 and bethuel begat rebekah: these eight milcah did bear to nahor,
abraham' brother.

22:24 and hi concubine, whose name wa reumah, she bare also tebah,
and gaham, and thahash, and maachah.

23:1 and sarah wa an hundr and seven and twenti year old: these
wer the year of the life of sarah.

23:2 and sarah die in kirjatharba; the same is hebron in the land of
canaan: and abraham came to mourn for sarah, and to weep for her.

23:3 and abraham stood up from befor hi dead, and spake unto the
son of heth, saying, 23:4 I am a stranger and a sojourn with you:
giv me a possess of a buryingplac with you, that I may buri my
dead out of my sight.

23:5 and the children of heth answer abraham, say unto him, 23:6
hear us, my lord: thou art a mighti princ among us: in the choic of
our sepulchr buri thi dead; none of us shall withhold from thee his
sepulchre, but that thou mayest buri thi dead.

23:7 and abraham stood up, and bow himself to the peopl of the
land, even to the children of heth.

23:8 and he commun with them, saying, If it be your mind that i
should buri my dead out of my sight; hear me, and intreat for me to
ephron the son of zohar, 23:9 that he may give me the cave of
machpelah, which he hath, which is in the end of hi field; for as
much money as it is worth he shall give it me for a possess of a
buryingplac amongst you.

23:10 and ephron dwelt among the children of heth: and ephron the
hittit answer abraham in the audienc of the children of heth, even
of all that went in at the gate of hi city, saying, 23:11 nay, my
lord, hear me: the field give I thee, and the cave that is therein, i
giv it thee; in the presenc of the son of my peopl give I it thee:
buri thi dead.

23:12 and abraham bow down himself befor the peopl of the land.

23:13 and he spake unto ephron in the audienc of the peopl of the
land, saying, but if thou wilt give it, I pray thee, hear me: I will
giv thee money for the field; take it of me, and I will buri my dead
there.

23:14 and ephron answer abraham, say unto him, 23:15 My lord,
hearken unto me: the land is worth four hundr shekel of silver;
what is that betwixt me and thee? buri therefor thi dead.

23:16 and abraham hearken unto ephron; and abraham weigh to ephron
th silver, which he had name in the audienc of the son of heth,
four hundr shekel of silver, current money with the merchant.

23:17 and the field of ephron which wa in machpelah, which wa before
mamre, the field, and the cave which wa therein, and all the trees
that were in the field, that were in all the border round about, were
mad sure 23:18 unto abraham for a possess in the presenc of the
children of heth, befor all that went in at the gate of hi city.

23:19 and after this, abraham buri sarah hi wife in the cave of the
field of machpelah befor mamre: the same is hebron in the land of
canaan.

23:20 and the field, and the cave that is therein, were made sure unto
abraham for a possess of a buryingplac by the son of heth.

24:1 and abraham wa old, and well stricken in age: and the lord had
bless abraham in all things.

24:2 and abraham said unto hi eldest servant of hi house, that ruled
ov all that he had, put, I pray thee, thi hand under my thigh: 24:3
and I will make thee swear by the lord, the god of heaven, and the god
of the earth, that thou shalt not take a wife unto my son of the
daught of the canaanites, among whom I dwell: 24:4 but thou shalt
go unto my country, and to my kindred, and take a wife unto my son
isaac.

24:5 and the servant said unto him, peradventur the woman will not be
wil to follow me unto thi land: must I need bring thi son again
unto the land from whenc thou camest?  24:6 and abraham said unto
him, bewar thou that thou bring not my son thither again.

24:7 the lord god of heaven, which took me from my father' house, and
from the land of my kindred, and which spake unto me, and that sware
unto me, saying, unto thi seed will I give thi land; he shall send
hi angel befor thee, and thou shalt take a wife unto my son from
thence.

24:8 and if the woman will not be will to follow thee, then thou
shalt be clear from thi my oath: onli bring not my son thither again.

24:9 and the servant put hi hand under the thigh of abraham his
master, and sware to him concern that matter.

24:10 and the servant took ten camel of the camel of hi master, and
departed; for all the good of hi master were in hi hand: and he
arose, and went to mesopotamia, unto the citi of nahor.

24:11 and he made hi camel to kneel down without the citi by a well
of water at the time of the evening, even the time that women go out
to draw water.

24:12 and he said O lord god of my master abraham, I pray thee, send
m good speed thi day, and shew kind unto my master abraham.

24:13 behold, I stand here by the well of water; and the daughter of
th men of the citi come out to draw water: 24:14 and let it come to
pass, that the damsel to whom I shall say, let down thi pitcher, i
pray thee, that I may drink; and she shall say, drink, and I will give
thi camel drink also: let the same be she that thou hast appointed
for thi servant isaac; and therebi shall I know that thou hast shewed
kind unto my master.

24:15 and it came to pass, befor he had done speaking, that, behold,
rebekah came out, who wa born to bethuel, son of milcah, the wife of
nahor, abraham' brother, with her pitcher upon her shoulder.

24:16 and the damsel wa veri fair to look upon, a virgin, neither had
ani man known her: and she went down to the well, and fill her
pitcher, and came up.

24:17 and the servant ran to meet her, and said, let me, I pray thee,
drink a littl water of thi pitcher.

24:18 and she said, drink, my lord: and she hasted, and let down her
pitch upon her hand, and gave him drink.

24:19 and when she had done give him drink, she said, I will draw
wat for thi camel also, until they have done drinking.

24:20 and she hasted, and empti her pitcher into the trough, and ran
again unto the well to draw water, and drew for all hi camels.

24:21 and the man wonder at her held hi peace, to wit whether the
lord had made hi journey prosper or not.

24:22 and it came to pass, as the camel had done drinking, that the
man took a golden ear of half a shekel weight, and two bracelets
for her hand of ten shekel weight of gold; 24:23 and said, whose
daught art thou? tell me, I pray thee: is there room in thi father's
hous for us to lodg in?  24:24 and she said unto him, I am the
daught of bethuel the son of milcah, which she bare unto nahor.

24:25 she said moreov unto him, We have both straw and provender
enough, and room to lodg in.

24:26 and the man bow down hi head, and worship the lord.

24:27 and he said, bless be the lord god of my master abraham, who
hath not left destitut my master of hi merci and hi truth: I being
in the way, the lord led me to the hous of my master' brethren.

24:28 and the damsel ran, and told them of her mother' hous these
things.

24:29 and rebekah had a brother, and hi name wa laban: and laban ran
out unto the man, unto the well.

24:30 and it came to pass, when he saw the ear and bracelet upon
hi sister' hands, and when he heard the word of rebekah hi sister,
saying, thu spake the man unto me; that he came unto the man; and,
behold, he stood by the camel at the well.

24:31 and he said, come in, thou bless of the lord; wherefore
standest thou without? for I have prepar the house, and room for the
camels.

24:32 and the man came into the house: and he ungird hi camels, and
gav straw and provend for the camels, and water to wash hi feet,
and the men' feet that were with him.

24:33 and there wa set meat befor him to eat: but he said, I will
not eat, until I have told mine errand. and he said, speak on.

24:34 and he said, I am abraham' servant.

24:35 and the lord hath bless my master greatly; and he is become
great: and he hath given him flocks, and herds, and silver, and gold,
