and menservants, and maidservants, and camels, and asses.

24:36 and sarah my master' wife bare a son to my master when she was
old: and unto him hath he given all that he hath.

24:37 and my master made me swear, saying, thou shalt not take a wife
to my son of the daughter of the canaanites, in whose land I dwell:
24:38 but thou shalt go unto my father' house, and to my kindred, and
tak a wife unto my son.

24:39 and I said unto my master, peradventur the woman will not
follow me.

24:40 and he said unto me, the lord, befor whom I walk, will send his
angel with thee, and prosper thi way; and thou shalt take a wife for
mi son of my kindred, and of my father' house: 24:41 then shalt thou
b clear from thi my oath, when thou comest to my kindred; and if
they give not thee one, thou shalt be clear from my oath.

24:42 and I came thi day unto the well, and said, O lord god of my
mast abraham, if now thou do prosper my way which I go: 24:43
behold, I stand by the well of water; and it shall come to pass, that
when the virgin cometh forth to draw water, and I say to her, give me,
i pray thee, a littl water of thi pitcher to drink; 24:44 and she say
to me, both drink thou, and I will also draw for thi camels: let the
sam be the woman whom the lord hath appoint out for my master's
son.

24:45 and befor I had done speak in mine heart, behold, rebekah
cam forth with her pitcher on her shoulder; and she went down unto
th well, and drew water: and I said unto her, let me drink, I pray
thee.

24:46 and she made haste, and let down her pitcher from her shoulder,
and said, drink, and I will give thi camel drink also: so I drank,
and she made the camel drink also.

24:47 and I ask her, and said, whose daughter art thou? and she
said, the daughter of bethuel, nahor' son, whom milcah bare unto him:
and I put the ear upon her face, and the bracelet upon her hands.

24:48 and I bow down my head, and worship the lord, and blessed
th lord god of my master abraham, which had led me in the right way
to take my master' brother' daughter unto hi son.

24:49 and now if ye will deal kindli and truli with my master, tell
me: and if not, tell me; that I may turn to the right hand, or to the
left.

24:50 then laban and bethuel answer and said, the thing proceedeth
from the lord: we cannot speak unto thee bad or good.

24:51 behold, rebekah is befor thee, take her, and go, and let her be
thi master' son' wife, as the lord hath spoken.

24:52 and it came to pass, that, when abraham' servant heard their
words, he worship the lord, bow himself to the earth.

24:53 and the servant brought forth jewel of silver, and jewel of
gold, and raiment, and gave them to rebekah: he gave also to her
broth and to her mother preciou things.

24:54 and they did eat and drink, he and the men that were with him,
and tarri all night; and they rose up in the morning, and he said,
send me away unto my master.

24:55 and her brother and her mother said, let the damsel abid with
u a few days, at the least ten; after that she shall go.

24:56 and he said unto them, hinder me not, see the lord hath
prosp my way; send me away that I may go to my master.

24:57 and they said, We will call the damsel, and enquir at her
mouth.

24:58 and they call rebekah, and said unto her, wilt thou go with
thi man? and she said, I will go.

24:59 and they sent away rebekah their sister, and her nurse, and
abraham' servant, and hi men.

24:60 and they bless rebekah, and said unto her, thou art our
sister, be thou the mother of thousand of millions, and let thi seed
possess the gate of those which hate them.

24:61 and rebekah arose, and her damsels, and they rode upon the
camels, and follow the man: and the servant took rebekah, and went
hi way.

24:62 and isaac came from the way of the well lahairoi; for he dwelt
in the south country.

24:63 and isaac went out to medit in the field at the eventide: and
h lift up hi eyes, and saw, and, behold, the camel were coming.

24:64 and rebekah lift up her eyes, and when she saw isaac, she
light off the camel.

24:65 for she had said unto the servant, what man is thi that walketh
in the field to meet us? and the servant had said, It is my master:
therefor she took a vail, and cover herself.

24:66 and the servant told isaac all thing that he had done.

24:67 and isaac brought her into hi mother sarah' tent, and took
rebekah, and she becam hi wife; and he love her: and isaac was
comfort after hi mother' death.

25:1 then again abraham took a wife, and her name wa keturah.

25:2 and she bare him zimran, and jokshan, and medan, and midian, and
ishbak, and shuah.

25:3 and jokshan begat sheba, and dedan. and the son of dedan were
asshurim, and letushim, and leummim.

25:4 and the son of midian; ephah, and epher, and hanoch, and abidah,
and eldaah. all these were the children of keturah.

25:5 and abraham gave all that he had unto isaac.

25:6 but unto the son of the concubines, which abraham had, abraham
gav gifts, and sent them away from isaac hi son, while he yet lived,
eastward, unto the east country.

25:7 and these are the day of the year of abraham' life which he
lived, an hundr threescor and fifteen years.

25:8 then abraham gave up the ghost, and die in a good old age, an
old man, and full of years; and wa gather to hi people.

25:9 and hi son isaac and ishmael buri him in the cave of
machpelah, in the field of ephron the son of zohar the hittite, which
i befor mamre; 25:10 the field which abraham purchas of the sons
of heth: there wa abraham buried, and sarah hi wife.

25:11 and it came to pass after the death of abraham, that god blessed
hi son isaac; and isaac dwelt by the well lahairoi.

25:12 now these are the gener of ishmael, abraham' son, whom
hagar the egyptian, sarah' handmaid, bare unto abraham: 25:13 and
thes are the name of the son of ishmael, by their names, according
to their generations: the firstborn of ishmael, nebajoth; and kedar,
and adbeel, and mibsam, 25:14 and mishma, and dumah, and massa, 25:15
hadar, and tema, jetur, naphish, and kedemah: 25:16 these are the sons
of ishmael, and these are their names, by their towns, and by their
castles; twelv princ accord to their nations.

25:17 and these are the year of the life of ishmael, an hundr and
thirti and seven years: and he gave up the ghost and died; and was
gath unto hi people.

25:18 and they dwelt from havilah unto shur, that is befor egypt, as
thou goest toward assyria: and he die in the presenc of all his
brethren.

25:19 and these are the gener of isaac, abraham' son: abraham
begat isaac: 25:20 and isaac wa forti year old when he took rebekah
to wife, the daughter of bethuel the syrian of padanaram, the sister
to laban the syrian.

25:21 and isaac intreat the lord for hi wife, becaus she was
barren: and the lord wa intreat of him, and rebekah hi wife
conceived.

25:22 and the children struggl togeth within her; and she said, if
it be so, whi am I thus? and she went to enquir of the lord.

25:23 and the lord said unto her, two nation are in thi womb, and two
mann of peopl shall be separ from thi bowels; and the one
peopl shall be stronger than the other people; and the elder shall
serv the younger.

25:24 and when her day to be deliv were fulfilled, behold, there
wer twin in her womb.

25:25 and the first came out red, all over like an hairi garment; and
they call hi name esau.

25:26 and after that came hi brother out, and hi hand took hold on
esau' heel; and hi name wa call jacob: and isaac wa threescore
year old when she bare them.

25:27 and the boy grew: and esau wa a cun hunter, a man of the
field; and jacob wa a plain man, dwell in tents.

25:28 and isaac love esau, becaus he did eat of hi venison: but
rebekah love jacob.

25:29 and jacob sod pottage: and esau came from the field, and he was
faint: 25:30 and esau said to jacob, feed me, I pray thee, with that
sam red pottage; for I am faint: therefor wa hi name call edom.

25:31 and jacob said, sell me thi day thi birthright.

25:32 and esau said, behold, I am at the point to die: and what profit
shal thi birthright do to me?  25:33 and jacob said, swear to me
thi day; and he sware unto him: and he sold hi birthright unto
jacob.

25:34 then jacob gave esau bread and pottag of lentiles; and he did
eat and drink, and rose up, and went hi way: thu esau despis his
birthright.

26:1 and there wa a famin in the land, besid the first famin that
wa in the day of abraham. and isaac went unto abimelech king of the
philistin unto gerar.

26:2 and the lord appear unto him, and said, Go not down into egypt;
dwel in the land which I shall tell thee of: 26:3 sojourn in this
land, and I will be with thee, and will bless thee; for unto thee, and
unto thi seed, I will give all these countries, and I will perform the
oath which I sware unto abraham thi father; 26:4 and I will make thy
se to multipli as the star of heaven, and will give unto thi seed
al these countries; and in thi seed shall all the nation of the
earth be blessed; 26:5 becaus that abraham obey my voice, and kept
mi charge, my commandments, my statutes, and my laws.

26:6 and isaac dwelt in gerar: 26:7 and the men of the place ask him
of hi wife; and he said, she is my sister: for he fear to say, she
i my wife; lest, said he, the men of the place should kill me for
rebekah; becaus she wa fair to look upon.

26:8 and it came to pass, when he had been there a long time, that
abimelech king of the philistin look out at a window, and saw,
and, behold, isaac wa sport with rebekah hi wife.

26:9 and abimelech call isaac, and said, behold, of a sureti she is
thi wife; and how saidst thou, she is my sister? and isaac said unto
him, becaus I said, lest I die for her.

26:10 and abimelech said, what is thi thou hast done unto us? one of
th peopl might lightli have lien with thi wife, and thou shouldest
hav brought guilti upon us.

26:11 and abimelech charg all hi people, saying, He that toucheth
thi man or hi wife shall sure be put to death.

26:12 then isaac sow in that land, and receiv in the same year an
hundredfold: and the lord bless him.

26:13 and the man wax great, and went forward, and grew until he
becam veri great: 26:14 for he had possess of flocks, and
possess of herds, and great store of servants: and the philistines
envi him.

26:15 for all the well which hi father' servant had dig in the
day of abraham hi father, the philistin had stop them, and
fil them with earth.

26:16 and abimelech said unto isaac, Go from us; for thou art much
mighti than we.

26:17 and isaac depart thence, and pitch hi tent in the valley of
gerar, and dwelt there.

26:18 and isaac dig again the well of water, which they had digged
in the day of abraham hi father; for the philistin had stopped
them after the death of abraham: and he call their name after the
nam by which hi father had call them.

26:19 and isaac' servant dig in the valley, and found there a
wel of spring water.

26:20 and the herdmen of gerar did strive with isaac' herdmen,
saying, the water is ours: and he call the name of the well esek;
becaus they strove with him.

26:21 and they dig anoth well, and strove for that also: and he
cal the name of it sitnah.

26:22 and he remov from thence, and dig anoth well; and for
that they strove not: and he call the name of it rehoboth; and he
said, for now the lord hath made room for us, and we shall be fruitful
in the land.

26:23 and he went up from thenc to beersheba.

26:24 and the lord appear unto him the same night, and said, I am
th god of abraham thi father: fear not, for I am with thee, and will
bless thee, and multipli thi seed for my servant abraham' sake.

26:25 and he build an altar there, and call upon the name of the
lord, and pitch hi tent there: and there isaac' servant dig a
well.

26:26 then abimelech went to him from gerar, and ahuzzath one of his
friends, and phichol the chief captain of hi army.

26:27 and isaac said unto them, wherefor come ye to me, see ye
hat me, and have sent me away from you?  26:28 and they said, We saw
certainli that the lord wa with thee: and we said, let there be now
an oath betwixt us, even betwixt us and thee, and let us make a
coven with thee; 26:29 that thou wilt do us no hurt, as we have not
touch thee, and as we have done unto thee noth but good, and have
s thee away in peace: thou art now the bless of the lord.

26:30 and he made them a feast, and they did eat and drink.

26:31 and they rose up betim in the morning, and sware one to
another: and isaac sent them away, and they depart from him in
peace.

26:32 and it came to pass the same day, that isaac' servant came,
and told him concern the well which they had digged, and said unto
him, We have found water.

26:33 and he call it shebah: therefor the name of the citi is
beersheba unto thi day.

26:34 and esau wa forti year old when he took to wife judith the
daught of beeri the hittite, and bashemath the daughter of elon the
hittite: 26:35 which were a grief of mind unto isaac and to rebekah.

27:1 and it came to pass, that when isaac wa old, and hi eye were
dim, so that he could not see, he call esau hi eldest son, and said
unto him, My son: and he said unto him, behold, here am i.

27:2 and he said, behold now, I am old, I know not the day of my
death: 27:3 now therefor take, I pray thee, thi weapons, thi quiver
and thi bow, and go out to the field, and take me some venison; 27:4
and make me savouri meat, such as I love, and bring it to me, that i
may eat; that my soul may bless thee befor I die.

27:5 and rebekah heard when isaac spake to esau hi son. and esau went
to the field to hunt for venison, and to bring it.

27:6 and rebekah spake unto jacob her son, saying, behold, I heard thy
fath speak unto esau thi brother, saying, 27:7 bring me venison, and
mak me savouri meat, that I may eat, and bless thee befor the lord
befor my death.

27:8 now therefore, my son, obey my voic accord to that which i
command thee.

27:9 Go now to the flock, and fetch me from thenc two good kid of
th goats; and I will make them savouri meat for thi father, such as
h loveth: 27:10 and thou shalt bring it to thi father, that he may
eat, and that he may bless thee befor hi death.

27:11 and jacob said to rebekah hi mother, behold, esau my brother is
a hairi man, and I am a smooth man: 27:12 My father peradventur will
feel me, and I shall seem to him as a deceiver; and I shall bring a
curs upon me, and not a blessing.

27:13 and hi mother said unto him, upon me be thi curse, my son: only
obey my voice, and go fetch me them.

27:14 and he went, and fetched, and brought them to hi mother: and
hi mother made savouri meat, such as hi father loved.

27:15 and rebekah took goodli raiment of her eldest son esau, which
wer with her in the house, and put them upon jacob her younger son:
27:16 and she put the skin of the kid of the goat upon hi hands,
and upon the smooth of hi neck: 27:17 and she gave the savouri meat
and the bread, which she had prepared, into the hand of her son jacob.

27:18 and he came unto hi father, and said, My father: and he said,
her am I; who art thou, my son?  27:19 and jacob said unto his
father, I am esau thi first born; I have done accord as thou badest
me: arise, I pray thee, sit and eat of my venison, that thi soul may
bless me.

27:20 and isaac said unto hi son, how is it that thou hast found it
so quickly, my son? and he said, becaus the lord thi god brought it
to me.

27:21 and isaac said unto jacob, come near, I pray thee, that I may
feel thee, my son, whether thou be my veri son esau or not.

27:22 and jacob went near unto isaac hi father; and he felt him, and
said, the voic is jacob' voice, but the hand are the hand of esau.

27:23 and he discern him not, becaus hi hand were hairy, as his
broth esau' hands: so he bless him.

27:24 and he said, art thou my veri son esau? and he said, I am.

27:25 and he said, bring it near to me, and I will eat of my son's
venison, that my soul may bless thee. and he brought it near to him,
and he did eat: and he brought him wine and he drank.

27:26 and hi father isaac said unto him, come near now, and kiss me,
mi son.

27:27 and he came near, and kiss him: and he smell the smell of
hi raiment, and bless him, and said, see, the smell of my son is as
th smell of a field which the lord hath blessed: 27:28 therefor god
giv thee of the dew of heaven, and the fat of the earth, and
plenti of corn and wine: 27:29 let peopl serv thee, and nation bow
down to thee: be lord over thi brethren, and let thi mother' son bow
down to thee: curs be everi one that curseth thee, and bless be he
that blesseth thee.

27:30 and it came to pass, as soon as isaac had made an end of
bless jacob, and jacob wa yet scarc gone out from the presenc of
isaac hi father, that esau hi brother came in from hi hunting.

27:31 and he also had made savouri meat, and brought it unto his
father, and said unto hi father, let my father arise, and eat of his
son' venison, that thi soul may bless me.

27:32 and isaac hi father said unto him, who art thou? and he said, i
am thi son, thi firstborn esau.

27:33 and isaac trembl veri exceedingly, and said, who? where is he
that hath taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all
befor thou camest, and have bless him? yea, and he shall be
blessed.

27:34 and when esau heard the word of hi father, he cri with a
great and exceed bitter cry, and said unto hi father, bless me,
even me also, O my father.

27:35 and he said, thi brother came with subtilty, and hath taken away
thi blessing.

27:36 and he said, Is not he rightli name jacob? for he hath
suppl me these two times: he took away my birthright; and,
behold, now he hath taken away my blessing. and he said, hast thou not
reserv a bless for me?  27:37 and isaac answer and said unto
esau, behold, I have made him thi lord, and all hi brethren have i
given to him for servants; and with corn and wine have I sustained
him: and what shall I do now unto thee, my son?  27:38 and esau said
unto hi father, hast thou but one blessing, my father? bless me, even
m also, O my father. and esau lift up hi voice, and wept.

27:39 and isaac hi father answer and said unto him, behold, thy
dwel shall be the fat of the earth, and of the dew of heaven
from above; 27:40 and by thi sword shalt thou live, and shalt serve
thi brother; and it shall come to pass when thou shalt have the
dominion, that thou shalt break hi yoke from off thi neck.

27:41 and esau hate jacob becaus of the bless wherewith his
fath bless him: and esau said in hi heart, the day of mourning
for my father are at hand; then will I slay my brother jacob.

27:42 and these word of esau her elder son were told to rebekah: and
sh sent and call jacob her younger son, and said unto him, behold,
thi brother esau, as touch thee, doth comfort himself, purpos to
kil thee.

27:43 now therefore, my son, obey my voice; arise, flee thou to laban
mi brother to haran; 27:44 and tarri with him a few days, until thy
brother' furi turn away; 27:45 until thi brother' anger turn away
from thee, and he forget that which thou hast done to him: then I will
send, and fetch thee from thence: whi should I be depriv also of you
both in one day?  27:46 and rebekah said to isaac, I am weari of my
lif becaus of the daughter of heth: if jacob take a wife of the
daught of heth, such as these which are of the daughter of the
land, what good shall my life do me?  28:1 and isaac call jacob, and
bless him, and charg him, and said unto him, thou shalt not take a
wif of the daughter of canaan.

28:2 arise, go to padanaram, to the hous of bethuel thi mother's
father; and take thee a wife from thenc of the daugher of laban thy
mother' brother.

28:3 and god almighti bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply
thee, that thou mayest be a multitud of people; 28:4 and give thee
th bless of abraham, to thee, and to thi seed with thee; that thou
mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which god gave
unto abraham.

28:5 and isaac sent away jacob: and he went to padanaram unto laban,
son of bethuel the syrian, the brother of rebekah, jacob' and esau's
mother.

28:6 when esau saw that isaac had bless jacob, and sent him away to
padanaram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he bless him
h gave him a charge, saying, thou shalt not take a wife of the
daugh of canaan; 28:7 and that jacob obey hi father and his
mother, and wa gone to padanaram; 28:8 and esau see that the
daught of canaan pleas not isaac hi father; 28:9 then went esau
unto ishmael, and took unto the wive which he had mahalath the
daught of ishmael abraham' son, the sister of nebajoth, to be his
wife.

28:10 and jacob went out from beersheba, and went toward haran.

28:11 and he light upon a certain place, and tarri there all
night, becaus the sun wa set; and he took of the stone of that
place, and put them for hi pillows, and lay down in that place to
sleep.

28:12 and he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the
top of it reach to heaven: and behold the angel of god ascending
and descend on it.

28:13 and, behold, the lord stood abov it, and said, I am the lord
god of abraham thi father, and the god of isaac: the land whereon thou
liest, to thee will I give it, and to thi seed; 28:14 and thi seed
shal be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the
west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee
and in thi seed shall all the famili of the earth be blessed.

28:15 and, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places
whith thou goest, and will bring thee again into thi land; for i
wil not leav thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to
the of.

28:16 and jacob awak out of hi sleep, and he said, sure the lord
i in thi place; and I knew it not.

28:17 and he wa afraid, and said, how dread is thi place! thi is
non other but the hous of god, and thi is the gate of heaven.

28:18 and jacob rose up earli in the morning, and took the stone that
h had put for hi pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and pour oil
upon the top of it.

28:19 and he call the name of that place bethel: but the name of
that citi wa call luz at the first.

28:20 and jacob vow a vow, saying, If god will be with me, and will
keep me in thi way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and
raiment to put on, 28:21 So that I come again to my father' hous in
peace; then shall the lord be my god: 28:22 and thi stone, which i
hav set for a pillar, shall be god' house: and of all that thou
shalt give me I will sure give the tenth unto thee.

29:1 then jacob went on hi journey, and came into the land of the
peopl of the east.

29:2 and he looked, and behold a well in the field, and, lo, there
wer three flock of sheep lie by it; for out of that well they
wat the flocks: and a great stone wa upon the well' mouth.

29:3 and thither were all the flock gathered: and they roll the
ston from the well' mouth, and water the sheep, and put the stone
again upon the well' mouth in hi place.

29:4 and jacob said unto them, My brethren, whenc be ye? and they
said, Of haran are we.

29:5 and he said unto them, know ye laban the son of nahor? and they
said, We know him.

29:6 and he said unto them, Is he well? and they said, He is well:
and, behold, rachel hi daughter cometh with the sheep.

29:7 and he said, lo, it is yet high day, neither is it time that the
cattl should be gather together: water ye the sheep, and go and
fe them.

29:8 and they said, We cannot, until all the flock be gathered
together, and till they roll the stone from the well' mouth; then we
wat the sheep.

29:9 and while he yet spake with them, rachel came with her father's
sheep; for she kept them.

29:10 and it came to pass, when jacob saw rachel the daughter of laban
hi mother' brother, and the sheep of laban hi mother' brother,
that jacob went near, and roll the stone from the well' mouth, and
wat the flock of laban hi mother' brother.

29:11 and jacob kiss rachel, and lift up hi voice, and wept.

29:12 and jacob told rachel that he wa her father' brother, and that
h wa rebekah' son: and she ran and told her father.

29:13 and it came to pass, when laban heard the tide of jacob his
sister' son, that he ran to meet him, and embrac him, and kissed
him, and brought him to hi house. and he told laban all these things.

29:14 and laban said to him, sure thou art my bone and my flesh. and
h abod with him the space of a month.

29:15 and laban said unto jacob, becaus thou art my brother,
shouldest thou therefor serv me for nought? tell me, what shall thy
wag be?  29:16 and laban had two daughters: the name of the elder
wa leah, and the name of the younger wa rachel.

29:17 leah wa tender eyed; but rachel wa beauti and well
favoured.

29:18 and jacob love rachel; and said, I will serv thee seven years
for rachel thi younger daughter.

29:19 and laban said, It is better that I give her to thee, than that
i should give her to anoth man: abid with me.

29:20 and jacob serv seven year for rachel; and they seem unto
him but a few days, for the love he had to her.

29:21 and jacob said unto laban, give me my wife, for my day are
fulfilled, that I may go in unto her.

29:22 and laban gather togeth all the men of the place, and made a
feast.

29:23 and it came to pass in the evening, that he took leah his
daughter, and brought her to him; and he went in unto her.

29:24 and laban gave unto hi daughter leah zilpah hi maid for an
handmaid.

29:25 and it came to pass, that in the morning, behold, it wa leah:
and he said to laban, what is thi thou hast done unto me? did not i
serv with thee for rachel? wherefor then hast thou beguil me?
29:26 and laban said, It must not be so done in our country, to give
th younger befor the firstborn.

29:27 fulfil her week, and we will give thee thi also for the service
which thou shalt serv with me yet seven other years.

29:28 and jacob did so, and fulfil her week: and he gave him rachel
hi daughter to wife also.

29:29 and laban gave to rachel hi daughter bilhah hi handmaid to be
her maid.

29:30 and he went in also unto rachel, and he love also rachel more
than leah, and serv with him yet seven other years.

29:31 and when the lord saw that leah wa hated, he open her womb:
but rachel wa barren.

29:32 and leah conceived, and bare a son, and she call hi name
reuben: for she said, sure the lord hath look upon my affliction;
now therefor my husband will love me.

29:33 and she conceiv again, and bare a son; and said, becaus the
lord hath heard I wa hated, he hath therefor given me thi son also:
and she call hi name simeon.

29:34 and she conceiv again, and bare a son; and said, now thi time
wil my husband be join unto me, becaus I have born him three sons:
therefor wa hi name call levi.

29:35 and she conceiv again, and bare a son: and she said, now will
i prais the lord: therefor she call hi name judah; and left
bearing.

30:1 and when rachel saw that she bare jacob no children, rachel
envi her sister; and said unto jacob, give me children, or els i
die.

30:2 and jacob' anger wa kindl against rachel: and he said, Am i
in god' stead, who hath withheld from thee the fruit of the womb?
30:3 and she said, behold my maid bilhah, go in unto her; and she
shal bear upon my knees, that I may also have children by her.

30:4 and she gave him bilhah her handmaid to wife: and jacob went in
unto her.

30:5 and bilhah conceived, and bare jacob a son.

30:6 and rachel said, god hath judg me, and hath also heard my
voice, and hath given me a son: therefor call she hi name dan.

30:7 and bilhah rachel' maid conceiv again, and bare jacob a second
son.

30:8 and rachel said, with great wrestl have I wrestl with my
sister, and I have prevailed: and she call hi name naphtali.

30:9 when leah saw that she had left bearing, she took zilpah her
maid, and gave her jacob to wife.

30:10 and zilpah leah' maid bare jacob a son.

30:11 and leah said, A troop cometh: and she call hi name gad.

30:12 and zilpah leah' maid bare jacob a second son.

30:13 and leah said, happi am I, for the daughter will call me
blessed: and she call hi name asher.

30:14 and reuben went in the day of wheat harvest, and found
mandrak in the field, and brought them unto hi mother leah. then
rachel said to leah, give me, I pray thee, of thi son' mandrakes.

30:15 and she said unto her, Is it a small matter that thou hast taken
mi husband? and wouldest thou take away my son' mandrak also? and
rachel said, therefor he shall lie with thee to night for thi son's
mandrakes.

30:16 and jacob came out of the field in the evening, and leah went
out to meet him, and said, thou must come in unto me; for sure i
hav hire thee with my son' mandrakes. and he lay with her that
night.

30:17 and god hearken unto leah, and she conceived, and bare jacob
th fifth son.

30:18 and leah said, god hath given me my hire, becaus I have given
mi maiden to my husband: and she call hi name issachar.

30:19 and leah conceiv again, and bare jacob the sixth son.

30:20 and leah said, god hath endu me with a good dowry; now will my
husband dwell with me, becaus I have born him six sons: and she
cal hi name zebulun.

30:21 and afterward she bare a daughter, and call her name dinah.

30:22 and god rememb rachel, and god hearken to her, and opened
h womb.

30:23 and she conceived, and bare a son; and said, god hath taken away
mi reproach: 30:24 and she call hi name joseph; and said, the lord
shal add to me anoth son.

30:25 and it came to pass, when rachel had born joseph, that jacob
said unto laban, send me away, that I may go unto mine own place, and
to my country.

30:26 give me my wive and my children, for whom I have serv thee,
and let me go: for thou knowest my servic which I have done thee.

30:27 and laban said unto him, I pray thee, if I have found favour in
thin eyes, tarry: for I have learn by experi that the lord hath
bless me for thi sake.

30:28 and he said, appoint me thi wages, and I will give it.

30:29 and he said unto him, thou knowest how I have serv thee, and
how thi cattl wa with me.

30:30 for it wa littl which thou hadst befor I came, and it is now
increas unto a multitude; and the lord hath bless thee sinc my
coming: and now when shall I provid for mine own hous also?  30:31
and he said, what shall I give thee? and jacob said, thou shalt not
giv me ani thing: if thou wilt do thi thing for me, I will again
fe and keep thi flock.

30:32 I will pass through all thi flock to day, remov from thence
al the speckl and spot cattle, and all the brown cattl among
th sheep, and the spot and speckl among the goats: and of such
shal be my hire.

30:33 So shall my righteous answer for me in time to come, when it
shal come for my hire befor thi face: everi one that is not speckled
and spot among the goats, and brown among the sheep, that shall be
count stolen with me.

30:34 and laban said, behold, I would it might be accord to thy
word.

30:35 and he remov that day the he goat that were ringstrak and
spotted, and all the she goat that were speckl and spotted, and
everi one that had some white in it, and all the brown among the
sheep, and gave them into the hand of hi sons.

30:36 and he set three days' journey betwixt himself and jacob: and
jacob fed the rest of laban' flocks.

30:37 and jacob took him rod of green poplar, and of the hazel and
chesnut tree; and pill white strake in them, and made the white
appear which wa in the rods.

30:38 and he set the rod which he had pill befor the flock in the
gutt in the water trough when the flock came to drink, that
they should conceiv when they came to drink.

30:39 and the flock conceiv befor the rods, and brought forth
cattl ringstraked, speckled, and spotted.

30:40 and jacob did separ the lambs, and set the face of the
flock toward the ringstraked, and all the brown in the flock of
laban; and he put hi own flock by themselves, and put them not unto
laban' cattle.

30:41 and it came to pass, whensoev the stronger cattl did
conceive, that jacob laid the rod befor the eye of the cattl in
th gutters, that they might conceiv among the rods.

30:42 but when the cattl were feeble, he put them not in: so the
feebl were laban's, and the stronger jacob's.

30:43 and the man increas exceedingly, and had much cattle, and
maidservants, and menservants, and camels, and asses.

31:1 and he heard the word of laban' sons, saying, jacob hath taken
away all that wa our father's; and of that which wa our father's
hath he gotten all thi glory.

31:2 and jacob beheld the counten of laban, and, behold, it was
not toward him as before.

31:3 and the lord said unto jacob, return unto the land of thy
fathers, and to thi kindred; and I will be with thee.

31:4 and jacob sent and call rachel and leah to the field unto his
flock, 31:5 and said unto them, I see your father' countenance, that
it is not toward me as before; but the god of my father hath been with
me.

31:6 and ye know that with all my power I have serv your father.

31:7 and your father hath deceiv me, and chang my wage ten times;
but god suffer him not to hurt me.

31:8 If he said thus, the speckl shall be thi wages; then all the
cattl bare speckled: and if he said thus, the ringstrak shall be
thi hire; then bare all the cattl ringstraked.

31:9 thu god hath taken away the cattl of your father, and given
them to me.

31:10 and it came to pass at the time that the cattl conceived, that
i lift up mine eyes, and saw in a dream, and, behold, the ram which
leap upon the cattl were ringstraked, speckled, and grisled.

31:11 and the angel of god spake unto me in a dream, saying, jacob:
and I said, here am i.

31:12 and he said, lift up now thine eyes, and see, all the ram which
leap upon the cattl are ringstraked, speckled, and grisled: for i
hav seen all that laban doeth unto thee.

31:13 I am the god of bethel, where thou anointedst the pillar, and
wher thou vowedst a vow unto me: now arise, get thee out from this
land, and return unto the land of thi kindred.

31:14 and rachel and leah answer and said unto him, Is there yet any
port or inherit for us in our father' house?  31:15 are we not
count of him strangers? for he hath sold us, and hath quit devoured
also our money.

31:16 for all the rich which god hath taken from our father, that is
ours, and our children's: now then, whatsoev god hath said unto
thee, do.

31:17 then jacob rose up, and set hi son and hi wive upon camels;
31:18 and he carri away all hi cattle, and all hi good which he
had gotten, the cattl of hi getting, which he had gotten in
padanaram, for to go to isaac hi father in the land of canaan.

31:19 and laban went to shear hi sheep: and rachel had stolen the
imag that were her father's.

31:20 and jacob stole away unawar to laban the syrian, in that he
told him not that he fled.

31:21 So he fled with all that he had; and he rose up, and pass over
th river, and set hi face toward the mount gilead.

31:22 and it wa told laban on the third day that jacob wa fled.

31:23 and he took hi brethren with him, and pursu after him seven
days' journey; and they overtook him in the mount gilead.

31:24 and god came to laban the syrian in a dream by night, and said
unto him, take heed that thou speak not to jacob either good or bad.

31:25 then laban overtook jacob. now jacob had pitch hi tent in the
mount: and laban with hi brethren pitch in the mount of gilead.

31:26 and laban said to jacob, what hast thou done, that thou hast
stolen away unawar to me, and carri away my daughters, as captives
taken with the sword?  31:27 wherefor didst thou flee away secretly,
and steal away from me; and didst not tell me, that I might have sent
the away with mirth, and with songs, with tabret, and with harp?
31:28 and hast not suffer me to kiss my son and my daughters? thou
hast now done foolishli in so doing.

31:29 It is in the power of my hand to do you hurt: but the god of
your father spake unto me yesternight, saying, take thou heed that
thou speak not to jacob either good or bad.

31:30 and now, though thou wouldest need be gone, becaus thou sore
longedst after thi father' house, yet wherefor hast thou stolen my
gods?  31:31 and jacob answer and said to laban, becaus I was
afraid: for I said, peradventur thou wouldest take by forc thy
daught from me.

31:32 with whomsoev thou findest thi gods, let him not live: before
our brethren discern thou what is thine with me, and take it to thee.
for jacob knew not that rachel had stolen them.

31:33 and laban went into jacob' tent, and into leah' tent, and into
th two maidservants' tents; but he found them not. then went he out
of leah' tent, and enter into rachel' tent.

31:34 now rachel had taken the images, and put them in the camel's
furniture, and sat upon them. and laban search all the tent, but
found them not.

31:35 and she said to her father, let it not displeas my lord that i
cannot rise up befor thee; for the custom of women is upon me. and he
search but found not the images.

31:36 and jacob wa wroth, and chode with laban: and jacob answered
and said to laban, what is my trespass? what is my sin, that thou hast
so hotli pursu after me?  31:37 wherea thou hast search all my
stuff, what hast thou found of all thi household stuff? set it here
befor my brethren and thi brethren, that they may judg betwixt us
both.

31:38 thi twenti year have I been with thee; thi ewe and thi she
goat have not cast their young, and the ram of thi flock have I not
eaten.

31:39 that which wa torn of beast I brought not unto thee; I bare
th loss of it; of my hand didst thou requir it, whether stolen by
day, or stolen by night.

31:40 thu I was; in the day the drought consum me, and the frost by
night; and my sleep depart from mine eyes.

31:41 thu have I been twenti year in thi house; I serv thee
fourteen year for thi two daughters, and six year for thi cattle:
and thou hast chang my wage ten times.

31:42 except the god of my father, the god of abraham, and the fear of
isaac, had been with me, sure thou hadst sent me away now empty. god
hath seen mine afflict and the labour of my hands, and rebuk thee
yesternight.

31:43 and laban answer and said unto jacob, these daughter are my
daughters, and these children are my children, and these cattl are my
cattle, and all that thou seest is mine: and what can I do thi day
unto these my daughters, or unto their children which they have born?
31:44 now therefor come thou, let us make a covenant, I and thou; and
let it be for a wit between me and thee.

31:45 and jacob took a stone, and set it up for a pillar.

31:46 and jacob said unto hi brethren, gather stones; and they took
stones, and made an heap: and they did eat there upon the heap.

31:47 and laban call it jegarsahadutha: but jacob call it galeed.

31:48 and laban said, thi heap is a wit between me and thee this
day.

therefor wa the name of it call galeed; 31:49 and mizpah; for he
said, the lord watch between me and thee, when we are absent one from
another.

31:50 If thou shalt afflict my daughters, or if thou shalt take other
w besid my daughters, no man is with us; see, god is witness
betwixt me and thee.

31:51 and laban said to jacob, behold thi heap, and behold this
pillar, which I have cast betwixt me and thee: 31:52 thi heap be
witness, and thi pillar be witness, that I will not pass over this
heap to thee, and that thou shalt not pass over thi heap and this
pillar unto me, for harm.

31:53 the god of abraham, and the god of nahor, the god of their
father, judg betwixt us. and jacob sware by the fear of hi father
isaac.

31:54 then jacob offer sacrific upon the mount, and call his
brethren to eat bread: and they did eat bread, and tarri all night
in the mount.

31:55 and earli in the morn laban rose up, and kiss hi son and
hi daughters, and bless them: and laban departed, and return unto
hi place.

32:1 and jacob went on hi way, and the angel of god met him.

32:2 and when jacob saw them, he said, thi is god' host: and he
cal the name of that place mahanaim.

32:3 and jacob sent messeng befor him to esau hi brother unto the
land of seir, the countri of edom.

32:4 and he command them, saying, thu shall ye speak unto my lord
esau; thi servant jacob saith thus, I have sojourn with laban, and
stay there until now: 32:5 and I have oxen, and asses, flocks, and
menservants, and womenservants: and I have sent to tell my lord, that
i may find grace in thi sight.

32:6 and the messeng return to jacob, saying, We came to thy
broth esau, and also he cometh to meet thee, and four hundr men
with him.

32:7 then jacob wa greatli afraid and distressed: and he divid the
peopl that wa with him, and the flocks, and herds, and the camels,
into two bands; 32:8 and said, If esau come to the one company, and
smit it, then the other compani which is left shall escape.

32:9 and jacob said, O god of my father abraham, and god of my father
isaac, the lord which saidst unto me, return unto thi country, and to
thi kindred, and I will deal well with thee: 32:10 I am not worthi of
th least of all the mercies, and of all the truth, which thou hast
shew unto thi servant; for with my staff I pass over thi jordan;
and now I am becom two bands.

32:11 deliv me, I pray thee, from the hand of my brother, from the
hand of esau: for I fear him, lest he will come and smite me, and the
moth with the children.

32:12 and thou saidst, I will sure do thee good, and make thi seed
a the sand of the sea, which cannot be number for multitude.

32:13 and he lodg there that same night; and took of that which came
to hi hand a present for esau hi brother; 32:14 two hundr she
goats, and twenti he goats, two hundr ewes, and twenti rams, 32:15
thirti milch camel with their colts, forti kine, and ten bulls,
twenti she asses, and ten foals.

32:16 and he deliv them into the hand of hi servants, everi drove
bi themselves; and said unto hi servants, pass over befor me, and
put a space betwixt drove and drove.

32:17 and he command the foremost, saying, when esau my brother
meeteth thee, and asketh thee, saying, whose art thou? and whither
goest thou? and whose are these befor thee?  32:18 then thou shalt
say, they be thi servant jacob's; it is a present sent unto my lord
esau: and, behold, also he is behind us.

32:19 and so command he the second, and the third, and all that
follow the droves, saying, On thi manner shall ye speak unto esau,
when ye find him.

32:20 and say ye moreover, behold, thi servant jacob is behind us. for
h said, I will appeas him with the present that goeth befor me, and
afterward I will see hi face; peradventur he will accept of me.

32:21 So went the present over befor him: and himself lodg that
night in the company.

32:22 and he rose up that night, and took hi two wives, and hi two
womenservants, and hi eleven sons, and pass over the ford jabbok.

32:23 and he took them, and sent them over the brook, and sent over
that he had.

32:24 and jacob wa left alone; and there wrestl a man with him
until the break of the day.

32:25 and when he saw that he prevail not against him, he touched
th hollow of hi thigh; and the hollow of jacob' thigh wa out of
joint, as he wrestl with him.

32:26 and he said, let me go, for the day breaketh. and he said, i
wil not let thee go, except thou bless me.

32:27 and he said unto him, what is thi name? and he said, jacob.

32:28 and he said, thi name shall be call no more jacob, but israel:
for as a princ hast thou power with god and with men, and hast
prevailed.

32:29 and jacob ask him, and said, tell me, I pray thee, thi name.
and he said, wherefor is it that thou dost ask after my name? and he
bless him there.

32:30 and jacob call the name of the place peniel: for I have seen
god face to face, and my life is preserved.

32:31 and as he pass over penuel the sun rose upon him, and he
halt upon hi thigh.

32:32 therefor the children of israel eat not of the sinew which
shrank, which is upon the hollow of the thigh, unto thi day: because
h touch the hollow of jacob' thigh in the sinew that shrank.

33:1 and jacob lift up hi eyes, and looked, and, behold, esau came,
and with him four hundr men. and he divid the children unto leah,
and unto rachel, and unto the two handmaids.

33:2 and he put the handmaid and their children foremost, and leah
and her children after, and rachel and joseph hindermost.

33:3 and he pass over befor them, and bow himself to the ground
seven times, until he came near to hi brother.

33:4 and esau ran to meet him, and embrac him, and fell on hi neck,
and kiss him: and they wept.

33:5 and he lift up hi eyes, and saw the women and the children;
and said, who are those with thee? and he said, the children which god
hath gracious given thi servant.

33:6 then the handmaiden came near, they and their children, and they
bow themselves.

33:7 and leah also with her children came near, and bow themselves:
and after came joseph near and rachel, and they bow themselves.

33:8 and he said, what meanest thou by all thi drove which I met? and
h said, these are to find grace in the sight of my lord.

33:9 and esau said, I have enough, my brother; keep that thou hast
unto thyself.

33:10 and jacob said, nay, I pray thee, if now I have found grace in
thi sight, then receiv my present at my hand: for therefor I have
seen thi face, as though I had seen the face of god, and thou wast
pleas with me.

33:11 take, I pray thee, my bless that is brought to thee; because
god hath dealt gracious with me, and becaus I have enough. and he
urg him, and he took it.

33:12 and he said, let us take our journey, and let us go, and I will
go befor thee.

33:13 and he said unto him, My lord knoweth that the children are
tender, and the flock and herd with young are with me: and if men
should overdr them one day, all the flock will die.

33:14 let my lord, I pray thee, pass over befor hi servant: and i
wil lead on softly, accord as the cattl that goeth befor me and
th children be abl to endure, until I come unto my lord unto seir.

33:15 and esau said, let me now leav with thee some of the folk that
ar with me. and he said, what needeth it? let me find grace in the
sight of my lord.

33:16 So esau return that day on hi way unto seir.

33:17 and jacob journey to succoth, and built him an house, and made
booth for hi cattle: therefor the name of the place is called
succoth.

33:18 and jacob came to shalem, a citi of shechem, which is in the
land of canaan, when he came from padanaram; and pitch hi tent
befor the city.

33:19 and he bought a parcel of a field, where he had spread hi tent,
at the hand of the children of hamor, shechem' father, for an hundred
piec of money.

33:20 and he erect there an altar, and call it eleloheisrael.

34:1 and dinah the daughter of leah, which she bare unto jacob, went
out to see the daughter of the land.

34:2 and when shechem the son of hamor the hivite, princ of the
country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defil her.

34:3 and hi soul clave unto dinah the daughter of jacob, and he loved
th damsel, and spake kindli unto the damsel.

34:4 and shechem spake unto hi father hamor, saying, get me this
damsel to wife.

34:5 and jacob heard that he had defil dinah hi daughter: now his
son were with hi cattl in the field: and jacob held hi peac until
they were come.

34:6 and hamor the father of shechem went out unto jacob to commune
with him.

34:7 and the son of jacob came out of the field when they heard it:
and the men were grieved, and they were veri wroth, becaus he had
wrought folli in israel in lie with jacob' daughter: which thing
ought not to be done.

34:8 and hamor commun with them, saying, the soul of my son shechem
longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.

34:9 and make ye marriag with us, and give your daughter unto us,
and take our daughter unto you.

34:10 and ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be befor you;
dwel and trade ye therein, and get you possess therein.

34:11 and shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, let me
find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.

34:12 ask me never so much dowri and gift, and I will give according
a ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.

34:13 and the son of jacob answer shechem and hamor hi father
deceitfully, and said, becaus he had defil dinah their sister:
34:14 and they said unto them, We cannot do thi thing, to give our
sist to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:
34:15 but in thi will we consent unto you: If ye will be as we be,
that everi male of you be circumcised; 34:16 then will we give our
daught unto you, and we will take your daughter to us, and we will
dwel with you, and we will becom one people.

34:17 but if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will
w take our daughter, and we will be gone.

34:18 and their word pleas hamor, and shechem hamor' son.

34:19 and the young man defer not to do the thing, becaus he had
delight in jacob' daughter: and he wa more honour than all the
hous of hi father.

34:20 and hamor and shechem hi son came unto the gate of their city,
and commun with the men of their city, saying, 34:21 these men are
peac with us; therefor let them dwell in the land, and trade
therein; for the land, behold, it is larg enough for them; let us
tak their daughter to us for wives, and let us give them our
daughters.

34:22 onli herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us,
to be one people, if everi male among us be circumcised, as they are
circumcised.

34:23 shall not their cattl and their substanc and everi beast of
their' be our's? onli let us consent unto them, and they will dwell
with us.

34:24 and unto hamor and unto shechem hi son hearken all that went
out of the gate of hi city; and everi male wa circumcised, all that
went out of the gate of hi city.

34:25 and it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that
two of the son of jacob, simeon and levi, dinah' brethren, took each
man hi sword, and came upon the citi boldly, and slew all the males.

34:26 and they slew hamor and shechem hi son with the edg of the
sword, and took dinah out of shechem' house, and went out.

34:27 the son of jacob came upon the slain, and spoil the city,
becaus they had defil their sister.

34:28 they took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that
which wa in the city, and that which wa in the field, 34:29 and all
their wealth, and all their littl ones, and their wive took they
captive, and spoil even all that wa in the house.

34:30 and jacob said to simeon and levi, Ye have troubl me to make
m to stink among the inhabit of the land, among the canaanites
and the perizzites: and I be few in number, they shall gather
themselv togeth against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed,
i and my house.

34:31 and they said, should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?
35:1 and god said unto jacob, arise, go up to bethel, and dwell there:
and make there an altar unto god, that appear unto thee when thou
fleddest from the face of esau thi brother.

35:2 then jacob said unto hi household, and to all that were with
him, put away the strang god that are among you, and be clean, and
chang your garments: 35:3 and let us arise, and go up to bethel; and
i will make there an altar unto god, who answer me in the day of my
distress, and wa with me in the way which I went.

35:4 and they gave unto jacob all the strang god which were in their
hand, and all their ear which were in their ears; and jacob hid
them under the oak which wa by shechem.

35:5 and they journeyed: and the terror of god wa upon the cities
that were round about them, and they did not pursu after the son of
jacob.

35:6 So jacob came to luz, which is in the land of canaan, that is,
bethel, he and all the peopl that were with him.

35:7 and he built there an altar, and call the place elbethel:
becaus there god appear unto him, when he fled from the face of his
brother.

35:8 but deborah rebekah' nurs died, and she wa buri beneath
bethel under an oak: and the name of it wa call allonbachuth.

35:9 and god appear unto jacob again, when he came out of padanaram,
and bless him.

35:10 and god said unto him, thi name is jacob: thi name shall not be
cal ani more jacob, but israel shall be thi name: and he call his
nam israel.

35:11 and god said unto him, I am god almighty: be fruit and
multiply; a nation and a compani of nation shall be of thee, and
k shall come out of thi loins; 35:12 and the land which I gave
abraham and isaac, to thee I will give it, and to thi seed after thee
wil I give the land.

35:13 and god went up from him in the place where he talk with him.

35:14 and jacob set up a pillar in the place where he talk with him,
even a pillar of stone: and he pour a drink offer thereon, and he
pour oil thereon.

35:15 and jacob call the name of the place where god spake with him,
bethel.

35:16 and they journey from bethel; and there wa but a littl way
to come to ephrath: and rachel travailed, and she had hard labour.

35:17 and it came to pass, when she wa in hard labour, that the
midwif said unto her, fear not; thou shalt have thi son also.

35:18 and it came to pass, as her soul wa in departing, (for she
died) that she call hi name benoni: but hi father call him
benjamin.

35:19 and rachel died, and wa buri in the way to ephrath, which is
bethlehem.

35:20 and jacob set a pillar upon her grave: that is the pillar of
rachel' grave unto thi day.

35:21 and israel journeyed, and spread hi tent beyond the tower of
edar.

35:22 and it came to pass, when israel dwelt in that land, that reuben
w and lay with bilhah hi father' concubine: and israel heard it.
now the son of jacob were twelve: 35:23 the son of leah; reuben,
jacob' firstborn, and simeon, and levi, and judah, and issachar, and
zebulun: 35:24 the son of rachel; joseph, and benjamin: 35:25 and the
son of bilhah, rachel' handmaid; dan, and naphtali: 35:26 and the
son of zilpah, leah' handmaid: gad, and asher: these are the son of
jacob, which were born to him in padanaram.

35:27 and jacob came unto isaac hi father unto mamre, unto the city
of arbah, which is hebron, where abraham and isaac sojourned.

35:28 and the day of isaac were an hundr and fourscor years.

35:29 and isaac gave up the ghost, and died, and wa gather unto his
people, be old and full of days: and hi son esau and jacob buried
him.

36:1 now these are the gener of esau, who is edom.

36:2 esau took hi wive of the daughter of canaan; adah the daughter
of elon the hittite, and aholibamah the daughter of anah the daughter
of zibeon the hivite; 36:3 and bashemath ishmael' daughter, sister of
nebajoth.

36:4 and adah bare to esau eliphaz; and bashemath bare reuel; 36:5 and
aholibamah bare jeush, and jaalam, and korah: these are the son of
esau, which were born unto him in the land of canaan.

36:6 and esau took hi wives, and hi sons, and hi daughters, and all
th person of hi house, and hi cattle, and all hi beasts, and all
hi substance, which he had got in the land of canaan; and went into
th countri from the face of hi brother jacob.

36:7 for their rich were more than that they might dwell together;
and the land wherein they were stranger could not bear them because
of their cattle.

36:8 thu dwelt esau in mount seir: esau is edom.

36:9 and these are the gener of esau the father of the edomites
in mount seir: 36:10 these are the name of esau' sons; eliphaz the
son of adah the wife of esau, reuel the son of bashemath the wife of
esau.

36:11 and the son of eliphaz were teman, omar, zepho, and gatam, and
kenaz.

36:12 and timna wa concubin to eliphaz esau' son; and she bare to
eliphaz amalek: these were the son of adah esau' wife.

36:13 and these are the son of reuel; nahath, and zerah, shammah, and
mizzah: these were the son of bashemath esau' wife.

36:14 and these were the son of aholibamah, the daughter of anah the
daught of zibeon, esau' wife: and she bare to esau jeush, and
jaalam, and korah.

36:15 these were duke of the son of esau: the son of eliphaz the
firstborn son of esau; duke teman, duke omar, duke zepho, duke kenaz,
36:16 duke korah, duke gatam, and duke amalek: these are the dukes
that came of eliphaz in the land of edom; these were the son of adah.

36:17 and these are the son of reuel esau' son; duke nahath, duke
zerah, duke shammah, duke mizzah: these are the duke that came of
reuel in the land of edom; these are the son of bashemath esau's
wife.

36:18 and these are the son of aholibamah esau' wife; duke jeush,
duk jaalam, duke korah: these were the duke that came of aholibamah
th daughter of anah, esau' wife.

36:19 these are the son of esau, who is edom, and these are their
dukes.

36:20 these are the son of seir the horite, who inhabit the land;
lotan, and shobal, and zibeon, and anah, 36:21 and dishon, and ezer,
and dishan: these are the duke of the horites, the children of seir
in the land of edom.

36:22 and the children of lotan were hori and hemam; and lotan's
sist wa timna.

36:23 and the children of shobal were these; alvan, and manahath, and
ebal, shepho, and onam.

36:24 and these are the children of zibeon; both ajah, and anah: this
wa that anah that found the mule in the wilderness, as he fed the
ass of zibeon hi father.

36:25 and the children of anah were these; dishon, and aholibamah the
daught of anah.

36:26 and these are the children of dishon; hemdan, and eshban, and
ithran, and cheran.

36:27 the children of ezer are these; bilhan, and zaavan, and akan.

36:28 the children of dishan are these; uz, and aran.

36:29 these are the duke that came of the horites; duke lotan, duke
shobal, duke zibeon, duke anah, 36:30 duke dishon, duke ezer, duke
dishan: these are the duke that came of hori, among their duke in
th land of seir.

36:31 and these are the king that reign in the land of edom, before
ther reign ani king over the children of israel.

36:32 and bela the son of beor reign in edom: and the name of his
citi wa dinhabah.

36:33 and bela died, and jobab the son of zerah of bozrah reign in
hi stead.

36:34 and jobab died, and husham of the land of temani reign in his
stead.

36:35 and husham died, and hadad the son of bedad, who smote midian in
th field of moab, reign in hi stead: and the name of hi citi was
avith.

36:36 and hadad died, and samlah of masrekah reign in hi stead.

36:37 and samlah died, and saul of rehoboth by the river reign in
hi stead.

36:38 and saul died, and baalhanan the son of achbor reign in his
stead.

36:39 and baalhanan the son of achbor died, and hadar reign in his
stead: and the name of hi citi wa pau; and hi wife' name was
mehetabel, the daughter of matred, the daughter of mezahab.

36:40 and these are the name of the duke that came of esau,
accord to their families, after their places, by their names; duke
timnah, duke alvah, duke jetheth, 36:41 duke aholibamah, duke elah,
duk pinon, 36:42 duke kenaz, duke teman, duke mibzar, 36:43 duke
magdiel, duke iram: these be the duke of edom, accord to their
habit in the land of their possession: he is esau the father of
th edomites.

37:1 and jacob dwelt in the land wherein hi father wa a stranger, in
th land of canaan.

37:2 these are the gener of jacob. joseph, be seventeen years
old, wa feed the flock with hi brethren; and the lad wa with the
son of bilhah, and with the son of zilpah, hi father' wives: and
joseph brought unto hi father their evil report.

37:3 now israel love joseph more than all hi children, becaus he
wa the son of hi old age: and he made him a coat of mani colours.

37:4 and when hi brethren saw that their father love him more than
al hi brethren, they hate him, and could not speak peaceabl unto
him.

37:5 and joseph dream a dream, and he told it hi brethren: and they
hat him yet the more.

37:6 and he said unto them, hear, I pray you, thi dream which I have
dreamed: 37:7 for, behold, we were bind sheav in the field, and,
lo, my sheaf arose, and also stood upright; and, behold, your sheaves
stood round about, and made obeis to my sheaf.

37:8 and hi brethren said to him, shalt thou inde reign over us? or
shalt thou inde have dominion over us? and they hate him yet the
mor for hi dreams, and for hi words.

37:9 and he dream yet anoth dream, and told it hi brethren, and
said, behold, I have dream a dream more; and, behold, the sun and
th moon and the eleven star made obeis to me.

37:10 and he told it to hi father, and to hi brethren: and his
fath rebuk him, and said unto him, what is thi dream that thou
hast dreamed?  shall I and thi mother and thi brethren inde come to
bow down ourselv to thee to the earth?  37:11 and hi brethren
envi him; but hi father observ the saying.

37:12 and hi brethren went to feed their father' flock in shechem.

37:13 and israel said unto joseph, Do not thi brethren feed the flock
in shechem? come, and I will send thee unto them. and he said to him,
her am i.

37:14 and he said to him, go, I pray thee, see whether it be well with
thi brethren, and well with the flocks; and bring me word again. So he
sent him out of the vale of hebron, and he came to shechem.

37:15 and a certain man found him, and, behold, he wa wander in
th field: and the man ask him, saying, what seekest thou?  37:16
and he said, I seek my brethren: tell me, I pray thee, where they feed
their flocks.

37:17 and the man said, they are depart hence; for I heard them say,
let us go to dothan. and joseph went after hi brethren, and found
them in dothan.

37:18 and when they saw him afar off, even befor he came near unto
them, they conspir against him to slay him.

37:19 and they said one to another, behold, thi dreamer cometh.

37:20 come now therefore, and let us slay him, and cast him into some
pit, and we will say, some evil beast hath devour him: and we shall
se what will becom of hi dreams.

37:21 and reuben heard it, and he deliv him out of their hands;
and said, let us not kill him.

37:22 and reuben said unto them, shed no blood, but cast him into this
pit that is in the wilderness, and lay no hand upon him; that he might
rid him out of their hands, to deliv him to hi father again.

37:23 and it came to pass, when joseph wa come unto hi brethren,
that they stript joseph out of hi coat, hi coat of mani colour that
wa on him; 37:24 and they took him, and cast him into a pit: and the
pit wa empty, there wa no water in it.

37:25 and they sat down to eat bread: and they lift up their eyes
and looked, and, behold, a compani of ishmeelit came from gilead
with their camel bear spiceri and balm and myrrh, go to carry
it down to egypt.

37:26 and judah said unto hi brethren, what profit is it if we slay
our brother, and conceal hi blood?  37:27 come, and let us sell him
to the ishmeelites, and let not our hand be upon him; for he is our
broth and our flesh. and hi brethren were content.

37:28 then there pass by midianit merchantmen; and they drew and
lift up joseph out of the pit, and sold joseph to the ishmeelites
for twenti piec of silver: and they brought joseph into egypt.

37:29 and reuben return unto the pit; and, behold, joseph wa not in
th pit; and he rent hi clothes.

37:30 and he return unto hi brethren, and said, the child is not;
and I, whither shall I go?  37:31 and they took joseph' coat, and
kil a kid of the goats, and dip the coat in the blood; 37:32 and
they sent the coat of mani colours, and they brought it to their
father; and said, thi have we found: know now whether it be thi son's
coat or no.

37:33 and he knew it, and said, It is my son' coat; an evil beast
hath devour him; joseph is without doubt rent in pieces.

37:34 and jacob rent hi clothes, and put sackcloth upon hi loins,
and mourn for hi son mani days.

37:35 and all hi son and all hi daughter rose up to comfort him;
but he refus to be comforted; and he said, for I will go down into
th grave unto my son mourning. thu hi father wept for him.

37:36 and the midianit sold him into egypt unto potiphar, an officer
of pharaoh's, and captain of the guard.

38:1 and it came to pass at that time, that judah went down from his
brethren, and turn in to a certain adullamite, whose name wa hirah.

38:2 and judah saw there a daughter of a certain canaanite, whose name
wa shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.

38:3 and she conceived, and bare a son; and he call hi name er.

38:4 and she conceiv again, and bare a son; and she call hi name
onan.

38:5 and she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and call hi name
shelah: and he wa at chezib, when she bare him.

38:6 and judah took a wife for Er hi firstborn, whose name wa tamar.

38:7 and er, judah' firstborn, wa wick in the sight of the lord;
and the lord slew him.

38:8 and judah said unto onan, Go in unto thi brother' wife, and
marri her, and rais up seed to thi brother.

38:9 and onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to
pass, when he went in unto hi brother' wife, that he spill it on
th ground, lest that he should give seed to hi brother.

38:10 and the thing which he did displeas the lord: wherefor he
slew him also.

38:11 then said judah to tamar hi daughter in law, remain a widow at
thi father' house, till shelah my son be grown: for he said, lest
peradventur he die also, as hi brethren did. and tamar went and
dwelt in her father' house.

38:12 and in process of time the daughter of shuah judah' wife died;
and judah wa comforted, and went up unto hi sheepshear to
timnath, he and hi friend hirah the adullamite.

38:13 and it wa told tamar, saying, behold thi father in law goeth up
to timnath to shear hi sheep.

38:14 and she put her widow' garment off from her, and cover her
with a vail, and wrap herself, and sat in an open place, which is
bi the way to timnath; for she saw that shelah wa grown, and she was
not given unto him to wife.

38:15 when judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; becaus she
had cover her face.

38:16 and he turn unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee,
let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she wa hi daughter
in law.) and she said, what wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come
in unto me?  38:17 and he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock.
and she said, wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?  38:18
and he said, what pledg shall I give thee? and she said, thi signet,
and thi bracelets, and thi staff that is in thine hand. and he gave it
her, and came in unto her, and she conceiv by him.

38:19 and she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and
put on the garment of her widowhood.

38:20 and judah sent the kid by the hand of hi friend the adullamite,
to receiv hi pledg from the woman' hand: but he found her not.

38:21 then he ask the men of that place, saying, where is the
harlot, that wa openli by the way side? and they said, there wa no
harlot in thi place.

38:22 and he return to judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also
th men of the place said, that there wa no harlot in thi place.

38:23 and judah said, let her take it to her, lest we be shamed:
behold, I sent thi kid, and thou hast not found her.

38:24 and it came to pass about three month after, that it wa told
judah, saying, tamar thi daughter in law hath play the harlot; and
also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. and judah said, bring her
forth, and let her be burnt.

38:25 when she wa brought forth, she sent to her father in law,
saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said,
discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and
staff.

38:26 and judah acknowledg them, and said, she hath been more
right than I; becaus that I gave her not to shelah my son. and he
knew her again no more.

38:27 and it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold,
twin were in her womb.

38:28 and it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out
hi hand: and the midwif took and bound upon hi hand a scarlet
thread, saying, thi came out first.

38:29 and it came to pass, as he drew back hi hand, that, behold, his
broth came out: and she said, how hast thou broken forth? this
breach be upon thee: therefor hi name wa call pharez.

38:30 and afterward came out hi brother, that had the scarlet thread
upon hi hand: and hi name wa call zarah.

39:1 and joseph wa brought down to egypt; and potiphar, an offic of
pharaoh, captain of the guard, an egyptian, bought him of the hand of
th ishmeelites, which had brought him down thither.

39:2 and the lord wa with joseph, and he wa a prosper man; and he
wa in the hous of hi master the egyptian.

39:3 and hi master saw that the lord wa with him, and that the lord
mad all that he did to prosper in hi hand.

39:4 and joseph found grace in hi sight, and he serv him: and he
mad him overs over hi house, and all that he had he put into his
hand.

39:5 and it came to pass from the time that he had made him overseer
in hi house, and over all that he had, that the lord bless the
egyptian' hous for joseph' sake; and the bless of the lord was
upon all that he had in the house, and in the field.

39:6 and he left all that he had in joseph' hand; and he knew not
ought he had, save the bread which he did eat. and joseph wa a goodly
person, and well favoured.

39:7 and it came to pass after these things, that hi master' wife
cast her eye upon joseph; and she said, lie with me.

39:8 but he refused, and said unto hi master' wife, behold, my
mast wotteth not what is with me in the house, and he hath committed
al that he hath to my hand; 39:9 there is none greater in thi house
than I; neither hath he kept back ani thing from me but thee, because
th art hi wife: how then can I do thi great wickedness, and sin
against god?  39:10 and it came to pass, as she spake to joseph day by
day, that he hearken not unto her, to lie by her, or to be with her.

39:11 and it came to pass about thi time, that joseph went into the
hous to do hi business; and there wa none of the men of the house
ther within.

39:12 and she caught him by hi garment, saying, lie with me: and he
left hi garment in her hand, and fled, and got him out.

39:13 and it came to pass, when she saw that he had left hi garment
in her hand, and wa fled forth, 39:14 that she call unto the men of
her house, and spake unto them, saying, see, he hath brought in an
hebrew unto us to mock us; he came in unto me to lie with me, and i
cri with a loud voice: 39:15 and it came to pass, when he heard that
i lift up my voic and cried, that he left hi garment with me, and
fled, and got him out.

39:16 and she laid up hi garment by her, until hi lord came home.

39:17 and she spake unto him accord to these words, saying, the
hebrew servant, which thou hast brought unto us, came in unto me to
mock me: 39:18 and it came to pass, as I lift up my voic and cried,
that he left hi garment with me, and fled out.

39:19 and it came to pass, when hi master heard the word of his
wife, which she spake unto him, saying, after thi manner did thy
serv to me; that hi wrath wa kindled.

39:20 and joseph' master took him, and put him into the prison, a
plac where the king' prison were bound: and he wa there in the
prison.

39:21 but the lord wa with joseph, and shew him mercy, and gave him
favour in the sight of the keeper of the prison.

39:22 and the keeper of the prison commit to joseph' hand all the
prison that were in the prison; and whatsoev they did there, he
wa the doer of it.

39:23 the keeper of the prison look not to ani thing that wa under
hi hand; becaus the lord wa with him, and that which he did, the
lord made it to prosper.

40:1 and it came to pass after these things, that the butler of the
k of egypt and hi baker had offend their lord the king of egypt.

40:2 and pharaoh wa wroth against two of hi officers, against the
chief of the butlers, and against the chief of the bakers.

40:3 and he put them in ward in the hous of the captain of the guard,
into the prison, the place where joseph wa bound.

40:4 and the captain of the guard charg joseph with them, and he
serv them: and they continu a season in ward.

40:5 and they dream a dream both of them, each man hi dream in one
night, each man accord to the interpret of hi dream, the
butl and the baker of the king of egypt, which were bound in the
prison.

40:6 and joseph came in unto them in the morning, and look upon
them, and, behold, they were sad.

40:7 and he ask pharaoh' offic that were with him in the ward of
hi lord' house, saying, wherefor look ye so sadli to day?  40:8 and
they said unto him, We have dream a dream, and there is no
interpret of it. and joseph said unto them, Do not interpretations
belong to god? tell me them, I pray you.

40:9 and the chief butler told hi dream to joseph, and said to him,
in my dream, behold, a vine wa befor me; 40:10 and in the vine were
thre branches: and it wa as though it budded, and her blossom shot
forth; and the cluster thereof brought forth ripe grapes: 40:11 and
pharaoh' cup wa in my hand: and I took the grapes, and press them
into pharaoh' cup, and I gave the cup into pharaoh' hand.

40:12 and joseph said unto him, thi is the interpret of it: the
thre branch are three days: 40:13 yet within three day shall
pharaoh lift up thine head, and restor thee unto thi place: and thou
shalt deliv pharaoh' cup into hi hand, after the former manner
when thou wast hi butler.

40:14 but think on me when it shall be well with thee, and shew
kindness, I pray thee, unto me, and make mention of me unto pharaoh,
and bring me out of thi house: 40:15 for inde I wa stolen away out
of the land of the hebrews: and here also have I done noth that
they should put me into the dungeon.

40:16 when the chief baker saw that the interpret wa good, he
said unto joseph, I also wa in my dream, and, behold, I had three
whit basket on my head: 40:17 and in the uppermost basket there was
of all manner of bakemeat for pharaoh; and the bird did eat them out
of the basket upon my head.

40:18 and joseph answer and said, thi is the interpretation
thereof: the three basket are three days: 40:19 yet within three days
shal pharaoh lift up thi head from off thee, and shall hang thee on a
tree; and the bird shall eat thi flesh from off thee.

40:20 and it came to pass the third day, which wa pharaoh' birthday,
that he made a feast unto all hi servants: and he lift up the head
of the chief butler and of the chief baker among hi servants.

40:21 and he restor the chief butler unto hi butlership again; and
h gave the cup into pharaoh' hand: 40:22 but he hang the chief
baker: as joseph had interpret to them.

40:23 yet did not the chief butler rememb joseph, but forgat him.

41:1 and it came to pass at the end of two full years, that pharaoh
dreamed: and, behold, he stood by the river.

41:2 and, behold, there came up out of the river seven well favoured
kin and fatfleshed; and they fed in a meadow.

41:3 and, behold, seven other kine came up after them out of the
river, ill favour and leanfleshed; and stood by the other kine upon
th brink of the river.

41:4 and the ill favour and leanflesh kine did eat up the seven
wel favour and fat kine. So pharaoh awoke.

41:5 and he slept and dream the second time: and, behold, seven ears
of corn came up upon one stalk, rank and good.

41:6 and, behold, seven thin ear and blast with the east wind
sprung up after them.

41:7 and the seven thin ear devour the seven rank and full ears.
and pharaoh awoke, and, behold, it wa a dream.

41:8 and it came to pass in the morn that hi spirit wa troubled;
and he sent and call for all the magician of egypt, and all the
wis men thereof: and pharaoh told them hi dream; but there wa none
that could interpret them unto pharaoh.

41:9 then spake the chief butler unto pharaoh, saying, I do remember
mi fault thi day: 41:10 pharaoh wa wroth with hi servants, and put
m in ward in the captain of the guard' house, both me and the chief
baker: 41:11 and we dream a dream in one night, I and he; we dreamed
each man accord to the interpret of hi dream.

41:12 and there wa there with us a young man, an hebrew, servant to
th captain of the guard; and we told him, and he interpret to us
our dreams; to each man accord to hi dream he did interpret.

41:13 and it came to pass, as he interpret to us, so it was; me he
restor unto mine office, and him he hanged.

41:14 then pharaoh sent and call joseph, and they brought him
hastili out of the dungeon: and he shave himself, and chang his
raiment, and came in unto pharaoh.

41:15 and pharaoh said unto joseph, I have dream a dream, and there
i none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of thee, that thou
canst understand a dream to interpret it.

41:16 and joseph answer pharaoh, saying, It is not in me: god shall
giv pharaoh an answer of peace.

41:17 and pharaoh said unto joseph, In my dream, behold, I stood upon
th bank of the river: 41:18 and, behold, there came up out of the
riv seven kine, fatflesh and well favoured; and they fed in a
meadow: 41:19 and, behold, seven other kine came up after them, poor
and veri ill favour and leanfleshed, such as I never saw in all the
land of egypt for badness: 41:20 and the lean and the ill favoured
kin did eat up the first seven fat kine: 41:21 and when they had
eaten them up, it could not be known that they had eaten them; but
they were still ill favoured, as at the beginning. So I awoke.

41:22 and I saw in my dream, and, behold, seven ear came up in one
stalk, full and good: 41:23 and, behold, seven ears, withered, thin,
and blast with the east wind, sprung up after them: 41:24 and the
thin ear devour the seven good ears: and I told thi unto the
magicians; but there wa none that could declar it to me.

41:25 and joseph said unto pharaoh, the dream of pharaoh is one: god
hath shew pharaoh what he is about to do.

41:26 the seven good kine are seven years; and the seven good ear are
seven years: the dream is one.

41:27 and the seven thin and ill favour kine that came up after them
ar seven years; and the seven empti ear blast with the east wind
shal be seven year of famine.

41:28 thi is the thing which I have spoken unto pharaoh: what god is
about to do he sheweth unto pharaoh.

41:29 behold, there come seven year of great plenti throughout all
th land of egypt: 41:30 and there shall aris after them seven years
of famine; and all the plenti shall be forgotten in the land of egypt;
and the famin shall consum the land; 41:31 and the plenti shall not
b known in the land by reason of that famin following; for it shall
b veri grievous.

41:32 and for that the dream wa doubl unto pharaoh twice; it is
becaus the thing is establish by god, and god will shortli bring it
to pass.

41:33 now therefor let pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise, and
set him over the land of egypt.

41:34 let pharaoh do this, and let him appoint offic over the land,
and take up the fifth part of the land of egypt in the seven plenteous
years.

41:35 and let them gather all the food of those good year that come,
and lay up corn under the hand of pharaoh, and let them keep food in
th cities.

41:36 and that food shall be for store to the land against the seven
year of famine, which shall be in the land of egypt; that the land
perish not through the famine.

41:37 and the thing wa good in the eye of pharaoh, and in the eyes
of all hi servants.

41:38 and pharaoh said unto hi servants, can we find such a one as
thi is, a man in whom the spirit of god is?  41:39 and pharaoh said
unto joseph, forasmuch as god hath shew thee all this, there is none
so discreet and wise as thou art: 41:40 thou shalt be over my house,
and accord unto thi word shall all my peopl be ruled: onli in the
thron will I be greater than thou.

41:41 and pharaoh said unto joseph, see, I have set thee over all the
land of egypt.

41:42 and pharaoh took off hi ring from hi hand, and put it upon
joseph' hand, and array him in vestur of fine linen, and put a
gold chain about hi neck; 41:43 and he made him to ride in the second
chariot which he had; and they cri befor him, bow the knee: and he
mad him ruler over all the land of egypt.
