41:44 and pharaoh said unto joseph, I am pharaoh, and without thee
shal no man lift up hi hand or foot in all the land of egypt.

41:45 and pharaoh call joseph' name zaphnathpaaneah; and he gave
him to wife asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of on. and
joseph went out over all the land of egypt.

41:46 and joseph wa thirti year old when he stood befor pharaoh
k of egypt. and joseph went out from the presenc of pharaoh, and
went throughout all the land of egypt.

41:47 and in the seven plenteou year the earth brought forth by
handfuls.

41:48 and he gather up all the food of the seven years, which were
in the land of egypt, and laid up the food in the cities: the food of
th field, which wa round about everi city, laid he up in the same.

41:49 and joseph gather corn as the sand of the sea, veri much,
until he left numbering; for it wa without number.

41:50 and unto joseph were born two son befor the year of famine
came, which asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of On bare unto
him.

41:51 and joseph call the name of the firstborn manasseh: for god,
said he, hath made me forget all my toil, and all my father' house.

41:52 and the name of the second call he ephraim: for god hath
caus me to be fruit in the land of my affliction.

41:53 and the seven year of plenteousness, that wa in the land of
egypt, were ended.

41:54 and the seven year of dearth began to come, accord as joseph
had said: and the dearth wa in all lands; but in all the land of
egypt there wa bread.

41:55 and when all the land of egypt wa famished, the peopl cri to
pharaoh for bread: and pharaoh said unto all the egyptians, Go unto
joseph; what he saith to you, do.

41:56 and the famin wa over all the face of the earth: and joseph
open all the storehouses, and sold unto the egyptians; and the
famin wax sore in the land of egypt.

41:57 and all countri came into egypt to joseph for to buy corn;
becaus that the famin wa so sore in all lands.

42:1 now when jacob saw that there wa corn in egypt, jacob said unto
hi sons, whi do ye look one upon another?  42:2 and he said, behold,
i have heard that there is corn in egypt: get you down thither, and
buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.

42:3 and joseph' ten brethren went down to buy corn in egypt.

42:4 but benjamin, joseph' brother, jacob sent not with hi brethren;
for he said, lest peradventur mischief befal him.

42:5 and the son of israel came to buy corn among those that came:
for the famin wa in the land of canaan.

42:6 and joseph wa the governor over the land, and he it wa that
sold to all the peopl of the land: and joseph' brethren came, and
bow down themselv befor him with their face to the earth.

42:7 and joseph saw hi brethren, and he knew them, but made himself
strang unto them, and spake roughli unto them; and he said unto them,
whenc come ye? and they said, from the land of canaan to buy food.

42:8 and joseph knew hi brethren, but they knew not him.

42:9 and joseph rememb the dream which he dream of them, and
said unto them, Ye are spies; to see the naked of the land ye are
come.

42:10 and they said unto him, nay, my lord, but to buy food are thy
serv come.

42:11 We are all one man' sons; we are true men, thi servant are no
spies.

42:12 and he said unto them, nay, but to see the naked of the land
y are come.

42:13 and they said, thi servant are twelv brethren, the son of one
man in the land of canaan; and, behold, the youngest is thi day with
our father, and one is not.

42:14 and joseph said unto them, that is it that I spake unto you,
saying, Ye are spies: 42:15 herebi ye shall be proved: By the life of
pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come
hither.

42:16 send one of you, and let him fetch your brother, and ye shall be
kept in prison, that your word may be proved, whether there be any
truth in you: or els by the life of pharaoh sure ye are spies.

42:17 and he put them all togeth into ward three days.

42:18 and joseph said unto them the third day, thi do, and live; for
i fear god: 42:19 If ye be true men, let one of your brethren be bound
in the hous of your prison: go ye, carri corn for the famin of your
houses: 42:20 but bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your
word be verified, and ye shall not die. and they did so.

42:21 and they said one to another, We are verili guilti concerning
our brother, in that we saw the anguish of hi soul, when he besought
us, and we would not hear; therefor is thi distress come upon us.

42:22 and reuben answer them, saying, spake I not unto you, saying,
do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore,
behold, also hi blood is required.

42:23 and they knew not that joseph understood them; for he spake unto
them by an interpreter.

42:24 and he turn himself about from them, and wept; and return to
them again, and commun with them, and took from them simeon, and
bound him befor their eyes.

42:25 then joseph command to fill their sack with corn, and to
restor everi man' money into hi sack, and to give them provision
for the way: and thu did he unto them.

42:26 and they lade their ass with the corn, and depart thence.

42:27 and as one of them open hi sack to give hi ass provend in
th inn, he espi hi money; for, behold, it wa in hi sack' mouth.

42:28 and he said unto hi brethren, My money is restored; and, lo, it
i even in my sack: and their heart fail them, and they were afraid,
say one to another, what is thi that god hath done unto us?  42:29
and they came unto jacob their father unto the land of canaan, and
told him all that befel unto them; saying, 42:30 the man, who is the
lord of the land, spake roughli to us, and took us for spi of the
country.

42:31 and we said unto him, We are true men; we are no spies: 42:32 we
b twelv brethren, son of our father; one is not, and the youngest
i thi day with our father in the land of canaan.

42:33 and the man, the lord of the country, said unto us, herebi shall
i know that ye are true men; leav one of your brethren here with me,
and take food for the famin of your households, and be gone: 42:34
and bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye are
no spies, but that ye are true men: so will I deliv you your
brother, and ye shall traffick in the land.

42:35 and it came to pass as they empti their sacks, that, behold,
everi man' bundl of money wa in hi sack: and when both they and
their father saw the bundl of money, they were afraid.

42:36 and jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereav of my
children: joseph is not, and simeon is not, and ye will take benjamin
away: all these thing are against me.

42:37 and reuben spake unto hi father, saying, slay my two sons, if i
br him not to thee: deliv him into my hand, and I will bring him
to thee again.

42:38 and he said, My son shall not go down with you; for hi brother
i dead, and he is left alone: if mischief befal him by the way in
th which ye go, then shall ye bring down my gray hair with sorrow to
th grave.

43:1 and the famin wa sore in the land.

43:2 and it came to pass, when they had eaten up the corn which they
had brought out of egypt, their father said unto them, Go again, buy
u a littl food.

43:3 and judah spake unto him, saying, the man did solemnli protest
unto us, saying, Ye shall not see my face, except your brother be with
you.

43:4 If thou wilt send our brother with us, we will go down and buy
the food: 43:5 but if thou wilt not send him, we will not go down:
for the man said unto us, Ye shall not see my face, except your
broth be with you.

43:6 and israel said, wherefor dealt ye so ill with me, as to tell
th man whether ye had yet a brother?  43:7 and they said, the man
ask us straitli of our state, and of our kindred, saying, Is your
fath yet alive? have ye anoth brother? and we told him according
to the tenor of these words: could we certainli know that he would
say, bring your brother down?  43:8 and judah said unto israel his
father, send the lad with me, and we will aris and go; that we may
live, and not die, both we, and thou, and also our littl ones.

43:9 I will be sureti for him; of my hand shalt thou requir him: if i
br him not unto thee, and set him befor thee, then let me bear the
blam for ever: 43:10 for except we had lingered, sure now we had
return thi second time.

43:11 and their father israel said unto them, If it must be so now, do
this; take of the best fruit in the land in your vessels, and carry
down the man a present, a littl balm, and a littl honey, spices, and
myrrh, nuts, and almonds: 43:12 and take doubl money in your hand;
and the money that wa brought again in the mouth of your sacks, carry
it again in your hand; peradventur it wa an oversight: 43:13 take
also your brother, and arise, go again unto the man: 43:14 and god
almighti give you merci befor the man, that he may send away your
oth brother, and benjamin. If I be bereav of my children, I am
bereaved.

43:15 and the men took that present, and they took doubl money in
their hand and benjamin; and rose up, and went down to egypt, and
stood befor joseph.

43:16 and when joseph saw benjamin with them, he said to the ruler of
hi house, bring these men home, and slay, and make ready; for these
men shall dine with me at noon.

43:17 and the man did as joseph bade; and the man brought the men into
joseph' house.

43:18 and the men were afraid, becaus they were brought into joseph's
house; and they said, becaus of the money that wa return in our
sack at the first time are we brought in; that he may seek occasion
against us, and fall upon us, and take us for bondmen, and our asses.

43:19 and they came near to the steward of joseph' house, and they
commun with him at the door of the house, 43:20 and said, O sir, we
cam inde down at the first time to buy food: 43:21 and it came to
pass, when we came to the inn, that we open our sacks, and, behold,
everi man' money wa in the mouth of hi sack, our money in full
weight: and we have brought it again in our hand.

43:22 and other money have we brought down in our hand to buy food:
w cannot tell who put our money in our sacks.

43:23 and he said, peac be to you, fear not: your god, and the god of
your father, hath given you treasur in your sacks: I had your money.
and he brought simeon out unto them.

43:24 and the man brought the men into joseph' house, and gave them
water, and they wash their feet; and he gave their ass provender.

43:25 and they made readi the present against joseph came at noon: for
they heard that they should eat bread there.

43:26 and when joseph came home, they brought him the present which
wa in their hand into the house, and bow themselv to him to the
earth.

43:27 and he ask them of their welfare, and said, Is your father
well, the old man of whom ye spake? Is he yet alive?  43:28 and they
answered, thi servant our father is in good health, he is yet alive.
and they bow down their heads, and made obeisance.

43:29 and he lift up hi eyes, and saw hi brother benjamin, his
mother' son, and said, Is thi your younger brother, of whom ye spake
unto me? and he said, god be graciou unto thee, my son.

43:30 and joseph made haste; for hi bowel did yearn upon his
brother: and he sought where to weep; and he enter into hi chamber,
and wept there.

43:31 and he wash hi face, and went out, and refrain himself, and
said, set on bread.

43:32 and they set on for him by himself, and for them by themselves,
and for the egyptians, which did eat with him, by themselves: because
th egyptian might not eat bread with the hebrews; for that is an
abomin unto the egyptians.

43:33 and they sat befor him, the firstborn accord to his
birthright, and the youngest accord to hi youth: and the men
marvel one at another.

43:34 and he took and sent mess unto them from befor him: but
benjamin' mess wa five time so much as ani of their's. and they
drank, and were merri with him.

44:1 and he command the steward of hi house, saying, fill the men's
sack with food, as much as they can carry, and put everi man' money
in hi sack' mouth.

44:2 and put my cup, the silver cup, in the sack' mouth of the
youngest, and hi corn money. and he did accord to the word that
joseph had spoken.

44:3 As soon as the morn wa light, the men were sent away, they
and their asses.

44:4 and when they were gone out of the city, and not yet far off,
joseph said unto hi steward, up, follow after the men; and when thou
dost overtak them, say unto them, wherefor have ye reward evil for
good?  44:5 Is not thi it in which my lord drinketh, and whereby
inde he divineth? ye have done evil in so doing.

44:6 and he overtook them, and he spake unto them these same words.

44:7 and they said unto him, wherefor saith my lord these words? god
forbid that thi servant should do accord to thi thing: 44:8
behold, the money, which we found in our sacks' mouths, we brought
again unto thee out of the land of canaan: how then should we steal
out of thi lord' hous silver or gold?  44:9 with whomsoev of thy
serv it be found, both let him die, and we also will be my lord's
bondmen.

44:10 and he said, now also let it be accord unto your words: he
with whom it is found shall be my servant; and ye shall be blameless.

44:11 then they speedili took down everi man hi sack to the ground,
and open everi man hi sack.

44:12 and he searched, and began at the eldest, and left at the
youngest: and the cup wa found in benjamin' sack.

44:13 then they rent their clothes, and lade everi man hi ass, and
return to the city.

44:14 and judah and hi brethren came to joseph' house; for he was
yet there: and they fell befor him on the ground.

44:15 and joseph said unto them, what deed is thi that ye have done?
wot ye not that such a man as I can certainli divine?  44:16 and judah
said, what shall we say unto my lord? what shall we speak?  or how
shal we clear ourselves? god hath found out the iniqu of thy
servants: behold, we are my lord' servants, both we, and he also with
whom the cup is found.

44:17 and he said, god forbid that I should do so: but the man in
whos hand the cup is found, he shall be my servant; and as for you,
get you up in peac unto your father.

44:18 then judah came near unto him, and said, Oh my lord, let thy
servant, I pray thee, speak a word in my lord' ears, and let not
thin anger burn against thi servant: for thou art even as pharaoh.

44:19 My lord ask hi servants, saying, have ye a father, or a
brother?  44:20 and we said unto my lord, We have a father, an old
man, and a child of hi old age, a littl one; and hi brother is
dead, and he alon is left of hi mother, and hi father loveth him.

44:21 and thou saidst unto thi servants, bring him down unto me, that
i may set mine eye upon him.

44:22 and we said unto my lord, the lad cannot leav hi father: for
if he should leav hi father, hi father would die.

44:23 and thou saidst unto thi servants, except your youngest brother
com down with you, ye shall see my face no more.

44:24 and it came to pass when we came up unto thi servant my father,
w told him the word of my lord.

44:25 and our father said, Go again, and buy us a littl food.

44:26 and we said, We cannot go down: if our youngest brother be with
us, then will we go down: for we may not see the man' face, except
our youngest brother be with us.

44:27 and thi servant my father said unto us, Ye know that my wife
bar me two sons: 44:28 and the one went out from me, and I said,
sur he is torn in pieces; and I saw him not since: 44:29 and if ye
tak thi also from me, and mischief befal him, ye shall bring down
mi gray hair with sorrow to the grave.

44:30 now therefor when I come to thi servant my father, and the lad
b not with us; see that hi life is bound up in the lad' life;
44:31 It shall come to pass, when he seeth that the lad is not with
us, that he will die: and thi servant shall bring down the gray hairs
of thi servant our father with sorrow to the grave.

44:32 for thi servant becam sureti for the lad unto my father,
saying, If I bring him not unto thee, then I shall bear the blame to
mi father for ever.

44:33 now therefore, I pray thee, let thi servant abid instead of the
lad a bondman to my lord; and let the lad go up with hi brethren.

44:34 for how shall I go up to my father, and the lad be not with me?
lest peradventur I see the evil that shall come on my father.

45:1 then joseph could not refrain himself befor all them that stood
bi him; and he cried, caus everi man to go out from me. and there
stood no man with him, while joseph made himself known unto his
brethren.

45:2 and he wept aloud: and the egyptian and the hous of pharaoh
heard.

45:3 and joseph said unto hi brethren, I am joseph; doth my father
yet live? and hi brethren could not answer him; for they were
troubl at hi presence.

45:4 and joseph said unto hi brethren, come near to me, I pray you.
and they came near. and he said, I am joseph your brother, whom ye
sold into egypt.

45:5 now therefor be not grieved, nor angri with yourselves, that ye
sold me hither: for god did send me befor you to preserv life.

45:6 for these two year hath the famin been in the land: and yet
ther are five years, in the which there shall neither be ear nor
harvest.

45:7 and god sent me befor you to preserv you a poster in the
earth, and to save your live by a great deliverance.

45:8 So now it wa not you that sent me hither, but god: and he hath
mad me a father to pharaoh, and lord of all hi house, and a ruler
throughout all the land of egypt.

45:9 hast ye, and go up to my father, and say unto him, thu saith
thi son joseph, god hath made me lord of all egypt: come down unto me,
tarri not: 45:10 and thou shalt dwell in the land of goshen, and thou
shalt be near unto me, thou, and thi children, and thi children's
children, and thi flocks, and thi herds, and all that thou hast: 45:11
and there will I nourish thee; for yet there are five year of famine;
lest thou, and thi household, and all that thou hast, come to poverty.

45:12 and, behold, your eye see, and the eye of my brother benjamin,
that it is my mouth that speaketh unto you.

45:13 and ye shall tell my father of all my glori in egypt, and of all
that ye have seen; and ye shall hast and bring down my father hither.

45:14 and he fell upon hi brother benjamin' neck, and wept; and
benjamin wept upon hi neck.

45:15 moreov he kiss all hi brethren, and wept upon them: and
aft that hi brethren talk with him.

45:16 and the fame thereof wa heard in pharaoh' house, saying,
joseph' brethren are come: and it pleas pharaoh well, and his
servants.

45:17 and pharaoh said unto joseph, say unto thi brethren, thi do ye;
lad your beasts, and go, get you unto the land of canaan; 45:18 and
tak your father and your households, and come unto me: and I will
giv you the good of the land of egypt, and ye shall eat the fat of
th land.

45:19 now thou art commanded, thi do ye; take you wagon out of the
land of egypt for your littl ones, and for your wives, and bring your
father, and come.

45:20 also regard not your stuff; for the good of all the land of
egypt is your's.

45:21 and the children of israel did so: and joseph gave them wagons,
accord to the command of pharaoh, and gave them provis for
th way.

45:22 To all of them he gave each man chang of raiment; but to
benjamin he gave three hundr piec of silver, and five chang of
raiment.

45:23 and to hi father he sent after thi manner; ten ass laden
with the good thing of egypt, and ten she ass laden with corn and
bread and meat for hi father by the way.

45:24 So he sent hi brethren away, and they departed: and he said
unto them, see that ye fall not out by the way.

45:25 and they went up out of egypt, and came into the land of canaan
unto jacob their father, 45:26 and told him, saying, joseph is yet
alive, and he is governor over all the land of egypt. and jacob's
heart fainted, for he believ them not.

45:27 and they told him all the word of joseph, which he had said
unto them: and when he saw the wagon which joseph had sent to carry
him, the spirit of jacob their father revived: 45:28 and israel said,
it is enough; joseph my son is yet alive: I will go and see him before
i die.

46:1 and israel took hi journey with all that he had, and came to
beersheba, and offer sacrific unto the god of hi father isaac.

46:2 and god spake unto israel in the vision of the night, and said,
jacob, jacob. and he said, here am i.

46:3 and he said, I am god, the god of thi father: fear not to go down
into egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation: 46:4 I will
go down with thee into egypt; and I will also sure bring thee up
again: and joseph shall put hi hand upon thine eyes.

46:5 and jacob rose up from beersheba: and the son of israel carried
jacob their father, and their littl ones, and their wives, in the
wagon which pharaoh had sent to carri him.

46:6 and they took their cattle, and their goods, which they had
gotten in the land of canaan, and came into egypt, jacob, and all his
se with him: 46:7 hi sons, and hi sons' son with him, his
daughters, and hi sons' daughters, and all hi seed brought he with
him into egypt.

46:8 and these are the name of the children of israel, which came
into egypt, jacob and hi sons: reuben, jacob' firstborn.

46:9 and the son of reuben; hanoch, and phallu, and hezron, and
carmi.

46:10 and the son of simeon; jemuel, and jamin, and ohad, and jachin,
and zohar, and shaul the son of a canaanitish woman.

46:11 and the son of levi; gershon, kohath, and merari.

46:12 and the son of judah; er, and onan, and shelah, and pharez, and
zarah: but Er and onan die in the land of canaan. and the son of
pharez were hezron and hamul.

46:13 and the son of issachar; tola, and phuvah, and job, and
shimron.

46:14 and the son of zebulun; sered, and elon, and jahleel.

46:15 these be the son of leah, which she bare unto jacob in
padanaram, with hi daughter dinah: all the soul of hi son and his
daught were thirti and three.

46:16 and the son of gad; ziphion, and haggi, shuni, and ezbon, eri,
and arodi, and areli.

46:17 and the son of asher; jimnah, and ishuah, and isui, and beriah,
and serah their sister: and the son of beriah; heber, and malchiel.

46:18 these are the son of zilpah, whom laban gave to leah his
daughter, and these she bare unto jacob, even sixteen souls.

46:19 the son of rachel jacob' wife; joseph, and benjamin.

46:20 and unto joseph in the land of egypt were born manasseh and
ephraim, which asenath the daughter of potipherah priest of On bare
unto him.

46:21 and the son of benjamin were belah, and becher, and ashbel,
gera, and naaman, ehi, and rosh, muppim, and huppim, and ard.

46:22 these are the son of rachel, which were born to jacob: all the
soul were fourteen.

46:23 and the son of dan; hushim.

46:24 and the son of naphtali; jahzeel, and guni, and jezer, and
shillem.

46:25 these are the son of bilhah, which laban gave unto rachel his
daughter, and she bare these unto jacob: all the soul were seven.

46:26 all the soul that came with jacob into egypt, which came out of
hi loins, besid jacob' sons' wives, all the soul were threescore
and six; 46:27 and the son of joseph, which were born him in egypt,
wer two souls: all the soul of the hous of jacob, which came into
egypt, were threescor and ten.

46:28 and he sent judah befor him unto joseph, to direct hi face
unto goshen; and they came into the land of goshen.

46:29 and joseph made readi hi chariot, and went up to meet israel
hi father, to goshen, and present himself unto him; and he fell on
hi neck, and wept on hi neck a good while.

46:30 and israel said unto joseph, now let me die, sinc I have seen
thi face, becaus thou art yet alive.

46:31 and joseph said unto hi brethren, and unto hi father' house,
i will go up, and shew pharaoh, and say unto him, My brethren, and my
father' house, which were in the land of canaan, are come unto me;
46:32 and the men are shepherds, for their trade hath been to feed
cattle; and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all
that they have.

46:33 and it shall come to pass, when pharaoh shall call you, and
shal say, what is your occupation?  46:34 that ye shall say, thy
servants' trade hath been about cattl from our youth even until now,
both we, and also our fathers: that ye may dwell in the land of
goshen; for everi shepherd is an abomin unto the egyptians.

47:1 then joseph came and told pharaoh, and said, My father and my
brethren, and their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have,
ar come out of the land of canaan; and, behold, they are in the land
of goshen.

47:2 and he took some of hi brethren, even five men, and presented
them unto pharaoh.

47:3 and pharaoh said unto hi brethren, what is your occupation? and
they said unto pharaoh, thi servant are shepherds, both we, and also
our fathers.

47:4 they said morev unto pharaoh, for to sojourn in the land are we
come; for thi servant have no pastur for their flocks; for the
famin is sore in the land of canaan: now therefore, we pray thee, let
thi servant dwell in the land of goshen.

47:5 and pharaoh spake unto joseph, saying, thi father and thy
brethren are come unto thee: 47:6 the land of egypt is befor thee; in
th best of the land make thi father and brethren to dwell; in the
land of goshen let them dwell: and if thou knowest ani men of activity
among them, then make them ruler over my cattle.

47:7 and joseph brought in jacob hi father, and set him before
pharaoh: and jacob bless pharaoh.

47:8 and pharaoh said unto jacob, how old art thou?  47:9 and jacob
said unto pharaoh, the day of the year of my pilgrimag are an
hundr and thirti years: few and evil have the day of the year of
mi life been, and have not attain unto the day of the year of the
lif of my father in the day of their pilgrimage.

47:10 and jacob bless pharaoh, and went out from befor pharaoh.

47:11 and joseph place hi father and hi brethren, and gave them a
possess in the land of egypt, in the best of the land, in the land
of rameses, as pharaoh had commanded.

47:12 and joseph nourish hi father, and hi brethren, and all his
father' household, with bread, accord to their families.

47:13 and there wa no bread in all the land; for the famin wa very
sore, so that the land of egypt and all the land of canaan faint by
reason of the famine.

47:14 and joseph gather up all the money that wa found in the land
of egypt, and in the land of canaan, for the corn which they bought:
and joseph brought the money into pharaoh' house.

47:15 and when money fail in the land of egypt, and in the land of
canaan, all the egyptian came unto joseph, and said, give us bread:
for whi should we die in thi presence? for the money faileth.

47:16 and joseph said, give your cattle; and I will give you for your
cattle, if money fail.

47:17 and they brought their cattl unto joseph: and joseph gave them
bread in exchang for horses, and for the flocks, and for the cattle
of the herds, and for the asses: and he fed them with bread for all
their cattl for that year.

47:18 when that year wa ended, they came unto him the second year,
and said unto him, We will not hide it from my lord, how that our
money is spent; my lord also hath our herd of cattle; there is not
ought left in the sight of my lord, but our bodies, and our lands:
47:19 wherefor shall we die befor thine eyes, both we and our land?
buy us and our land for bread, and we and our land will be servants
unto pharaoh: and give us seed, that we may live, and not die, that
th land be not desolate.

47:20 and joseph bought all the land of egypt for pharaoh; for the
egyptian sold everi man hi field, becaus the famin prevail over
them: so the land becam pharaoh's.

47:21 and as for the people, he remov them to citi from one end of
th border of egypt even to the other end thereof.

47:22 onli the land of the priest bought he not; for the priest had
a portion assign them of pharaoh, and did eat their portion which
pharaoh gave them: wherefor they sold not their lands.

47:23 then joseph said unto the people, behold, I have bought you this
day and your land for pharaoh: lo, here is seed for you, and ye shall
sow the land.

47:24 and it shall come to pass in the increase, that ye shall give
th fifth part unto pharaoh, and four part shall be your own, for
se of the field, and for your food, and for them of your households,
and for food for your littl ones.

47:25 and they said, thou hast save our lives: let us find grace in
th sight of my lord, and we will be pharaoh' servants.

47:26 and joseph made it a law over the land of egypt unto thi day,
that pharaoh should have the fifth part, except the land of the
priest only, which becam not pharaoh's.

47:27 and israel dwelt in the land of egypt, in the countri of goshen;
and they had possess therein, and grew, and multiplied
exceedingly.

47:28 and jacob live in the land of egypt seventeen years: so the
whol age of jacob wa an hundr forti and seven years.

47:29 and the time drew nigh that israel must die: and he call his
son joseph, and said unto him, If now I have found grace in thi sight,
put, I pray thee, thi hand under my thigh, and deal kindli and truly
with me; buri me not, I pray thee, in egypt: 47:30 but I will lie with
mi fathers, and thou shalt carri me out of egypt, and buri me in their
buryingplace. and he said, I will do as thou hast said.

47:31 and he said, swear unto me. and he sware unto him. and israel
bow himself upon the bed' head.

48:1 and it came to pass after these things, that one told joseph,
behold, thi father is sick: and he took with him hi two sons,
manasseh and ephraim.

48:2 and one told jacob, and said, behold, thi son joseph cometh unto
thee: and israel strengthen himself, and sat upon the bed.

48:3 and jacob said unto joseph, god almighti appear unto me at luz
in the land of canaan, and bless me, 48:4 and said unto me, behold,
i will make thee fruitful, and multipli thee, and I will make of thee
a multitud of people; and will give thi land to thi seed after thee
for an everlast possession.

48:5 and now thi two sons, ephraim and manasseh, which were born unto
the in the land of egypt befor I came unto thee into egypt, are
mine; as reuben and simeon, they shall be mine.

48:6 and thi issue, which thou begettest after them, shall be thine,
and shall be call after the name of their brethren in their
inheritance.

48:7 and as for me, when I came from padan, rachel die by me in the
land of canaan in the way, when yet there wa but a littl way to come
unto ephrath: and I buri her there in the way of ephrath; the same
i bethlehem.

48:8 and israel beheld joseph' sons, and said, who are these?  48:9
and joseph said unto hi father, they are my sons, whom god hath given
m in thi place. and he said, bring them, I pray thee, unto me, and i
wil bless them.

48:10 now the eye of israel were dim for age, so that he could not
see.

and he brought them near unto him; and he kiss them, and embraced
them.

48:11 and israel said unto joseph, I had not thought to see thi face:
and, lo, god hath shew me also thi seed.

48:12 and joseph brought them out from between hi knees, and he bowed
himself with hi face to the earth.

48:13 and joseph took them both, ephraim in hi right hand toward
israel' left hand, and manasseh in hi left hand toward israel's
right hand, and brought them near unto him.

48:14 and israel stretch out hi right hand, and laid it upon
ephraim' head, who wa the younger, and hi left hand upon manasseh's
head, guid hi hand wittingly; for manasseh wa the firstborn.

48:15 and he bless joseph, and said, god, befor whom my fathers
abraham and isaac did walk, the god which fed me all my life long unto
thi day, 48:16 the angel which redeem me from all evil, bless the
lads; and let my name be name on them, and the name of my fathers
abraham and isaac; and let them grow into a multitud in the midst of
th earth.

48:17 and when joseph saw that hi father laid hi right hand upon the
head of ephraim, it displeas him: and he held up hi father' hand,
to remov it from ephraim' head unto manasseh' head.

48:18 and joseph said unto hi father, not so, my father: for thi is
th firstborn; put thi right hand upon hi head.

48:19 and hi father refused, and said, I know it, my son, I know it:
h also shall becom a people, and he also shall be great: but truly
hi younger brother shall be greater than he, and hi seed shall
becom a multitud of nations.

48:20 and he bless them that day, saying, In thee shall israel
bless, saying, god make thee as ephraim and as manasseh: and he set
ephraim befor manasseh.

48:21 and israel said unto joseph, behold, I die: but god shall be
with you, and bring you again unto the land of your fathers.

48:22 moreov I have given to thee one portion abov thi brethren,
which I took out of the hand of the amorit with my sword and with my
bow.

49:1 and jacob call unto hi sons, and said, gather yourselves
together, that I may tell you that which shall befal you in the last
days.

49:2 gather yourselv together, and hear, ye son of jacob; and
hearken unto israel your father.

49:3 reuben, thou art my firstborn, my might, and the begin of my
strength, the excel of dignity, and the excel of power: 49:4
unstabl as water, thou shalt not excel; becaus thou wentest up to
thi father' bed; then defiledst thou it: he went up to my couch.

49:5 simeon and levi are brethren; instrument of cruelti are in their
habitations.

49:6 O my soul, come not thou into their secret; unto their assembly,
min honour, be not thou united: for in their anger they slew a man,
and in their selfwil they dig down a wall.

49:7 curs be their anger, for it wa fierce; and their wrath, for it
wa cruel: I will divid them in jacob, and scatter them in israel.

49:8 judah, thou art he whom thi brethren shall praise: thi hand shall
b in the neck of thine enemies; thi father' children shall bow down
befor thee.

49:9 judah is a lion' whelp: from the prey, my son, thou art gone up:
h stoop down, he couch as a lion, and as an old lion; who shall
rous him up?  49:10 the sceptr shall not depart from judah, nor a
lawgiv from between hi feet, until shiloh come; and unto him shall
th gather of the peopl be.

49:11 bind hi foal unto the vine, and hi ass' colt unto the
choic vine; he wash hi garment in wine, and hi cloth in the
blood of grapes: 49:12 hi eye shall be red with wine, and hi teeth
whit with milk.

49:13 zebulun shall dwell at the haven of the sea; and he shall be for
an haven of ships; and hi border shall be unto zidon.

49:14 issachar is a strong ass couch down between two burdens:
49:15 and he saw that rest wa good, and the land that it was
pleasant; and bow hi shoulder to bear, and becam a servant unto
tribute.

49:16 dan shall judg hi people, as one of the tribe of israel.

49:17 dan shall be a serpent by the way, an adder in the path, that
biteth the hors heels, so that hi rider shall fall backward.

49:18 I have wait for thi salvation, O lord.

49:19 gad, a troop shall overcom him: but he shall overcom at the
last.

49:20 out of asher hi bread shall be fat, and he shall yield royal
dainties.

49:21 naphtali is a hind let loose: he giveth goodli words.

49:22 joseph is a fruit bough, even a fruit bough by a well;
whos branch run over the wall: 49:23 the archer have sorely
griev him, and shot at him, and hate him: 49:24 but hi bow abode
in strength, and the arm of hi hand were made strong by the hands
of the mighti god of jacob; (from thenc is the shepherd, the stone of
israel:) 49:25 even by the god of thi father, who shall help thee; and
bi the almighty, who shall bless thee with bless of heaven above,
bless of the deep that lieth under, bless of the breasts, and
of the womb: 49:26 the bless of thi father have prevail above
th bless of my progenitor unto the utmost bound of the
everlast hills: they shall be on the head of joseph, and on the
crown of the head of him that wa separ from hi brethren.

49:27 benjamin shall ravin as a wolf: in the morn he shall devour
th prey, and at night he shall divid the spoil.

49:28 all these are the twelv tribe of israel: and thi is it that
their father spake unto them, and bless them; everi one accord to
hi bless he bless them.

49:29 and he charg them, and said unto them, I am to be gathered
unto my people: buri me with my father in the cave that is in the
field of ephron the hittite, 49:30 In the cave that is in the field of
machpelah, which is befor mamre, in the land of canaan, which abraham
bought with the field of ephron the hittit for a possess of a
buryingplace.

49:31 there they buri abraham and sarah hi wife; there they buried
isaac and rebekah hi wife; and there I buri leah.

49:32 the purchas of the field and of the cave that is therein was
from the children of heth.

49:33 and when jacob had made an end of command hi sons, he
gath up hi feet into the bed, and yield up the ghost, and was
gath unto hi people.

50:1 and joseph fell upon hi father' face, and wept upon him, and
kiss him.

50:2 and joseph command hi servant the physician to embalm his
father: and the physician embalm israel.

50:3 and forti day were fulfil for him; for so are fulfil the
day of those which are embalmed: and the egyptian mourn for him
threescor and ten days.

50:4 and when the day of hi mourn were past, joseph spake unto
th hous of pharaoh, saying, If now I have found grace in your eyes,
speak, I pray you, in the ear of pharaoh, saying, 50:5 My father made
m swear, saying, lo, I die: in my grave which I have dig for me in
th land of canaan, there shalt thou buri me. now therefor let me go
up, I pray thee, and buri my father, and I will come again.

50:6 and pharaoh said, Go up, and buri thi father, accord as he
mad thee swear.

50:7 and joseph went up to buri hi father: and with him went up all
th servant of pharaoh, the elder of hi house, and all the elders
of the land of egypt, 50:8 and all the hous of joseph, and his
brethren, and hi father' house: onli their littl ones, and their
flocks, and their herds, they left in the land of goshen.

50:9 and there went up with him both chariot and horsemen: and it was
a veri great company.

50:10 and they came to the threshingfloor of atad, which is beyond
jordan, and there they mourn with a great and veri sore lamentation:
and he made a mourn for hi father seven days.

50:11 and when the inhabit of the land, the canaanites, saw the
mourn in the floor of atad, they said, thi is a grievou mourning
to the egyptians: wherefor the name of it wa call abelmizraim,
which is beyond jordan.

50:12 and hi son did unto him accord as he command them: 50:13
for hi son carri him into the land of canaan, and buri him in
th cave of the field of machpelah, which abraham bought with the
field for a possess of a buryingplac of ephron the hittite, before
mamre.

50:14 and joseph return into egypt, he, and hi brethren, and all
that went up with him to buri hi father, after he had buri his
father.

50:15 and when joseph' brethren saw that their father wa dead, they
said, joseph will peradventur hate us, and will certainli requit us
al the evil which we did unto him.

50:16 and they sent a messeng unto joseph, saying, thi father did
command befor he died, saying, 50:17 So shall ye say unto joseph,
forgive, I pray thee now, the trespass of thi brethren, and their sin;
for they did unto thee evil: and now, we pray thee, forgiv the
trespass of the servant of the god of thi father. and joseph wept
when they spake unto him.

50:18 and hi brethren also went and fell down befor hi face; and
they said, behold, we be thi servants.

50:19 and joseph said unto them, fear not: for am I in the place of
god?  50:20 but as for you, ye thought evil against me; but god meant
it unto good, to bring to pass, as it is thi day, to save much people
alive.

50:21 now therefor fear ye not: I will nourish you, and your little
ones.

and he comfort them, and spake kindli unto them.

50:22 and joseph dwelt in egypt, he, and hi father' house: and
joseph live an hundr and ten years.

50:23 and joseph saw ephraim' children of the third generation: the
children also of machir the son of manasseh were brought up upon
joseph' knees.

50:24 and joseph said unto hi brethren, I die: and god will surely
visit you, and bring you out of thi land unto the land which he sware
to abraham, to isaac, and to jacob.

50:25 and joseph took an oath of the children of israel, saying, god
wil sure visit you, and ye shall carri up my bone from hence.

50:26 So joseph died, be an hundr and ten year old: and they
embalm him, and he wa put in a coffin in egypt.




th second book of moses:  call exodus


1:1 now these are the name of the children of israel, which came
into egypt; everi man and hi household came with jacob.

1:2 reuben, simeon, levi, and judah, 1:3 issachar, zebulun, and
benjamin, 1:4 dan, and naphtali, gad, and asher.

1:5 and all the soul that came out of the loin of jacob were seventy
souls: for joseph wa in egypt already.

1:6 and joseph died, and all hi brethren, and all that generation.

1:7 and the children of israel were fruitful, and increased
abundantly, and multiplied, and wax exceed mighty; and the land
wa fill with them.

1:8 now there aros up a new king over egypt, which knew not joseph.

1:9 and he said unto hi people, behold, the peopl of the children of
israel are more and mightier than we: 1:10 come on, let us deal wisely
with them; lest they multiply, and it come to pass, that, when there
falleth out ani war, they join also unto our enemies, and fight
against us, and so get them up out of the land.

1:11 therefor they did set over them taskmast to afflict them with
their burdens. and they built for pharaoh treasur cities, pithom and
raamses.

1:12 but the more they afflict them, the more they multipli and
grew.

and they were griev becaus of the children of israel.

1:13 and the egyptian made the children of israel to serv with
rigour: 1:14 and they made their live bitter with hard bondage, in
morter, and in brick, and in all manner of servic in the field: all
their service, wherein they made them serve, wa with rigour.

1:15 and the king of egypt spake to the hebrew midwives, of which the
nam of the one wa shiphrah, and the name of the other puah: 1:16 and
h said, when ye do the offic of a midwif to the hebrew women, and
se them upon the stools; if it be a son, then ye shall kill him: but
if it be a daughter, then she shall live.

1:17 but the midwiv fear god, and did not as the king of egypt
command them, but save the men children alive.

1:18 and the king of egypt call for the midwives, and said unto
them, whi have ye done thi thing, and have save the men children
alive?  1:19 and the midwiv said unto pharaoh, becaus the hebrew
women are not as the egyptian women; for they are lively, and are
deliv ere the midwiv come in unto them.

1:20 therefor god dealt well with the midwives: and the people
multiplied, and wax veri mighty.

1:21 and it came to pass, becaus the midwiv fear god, that he
mad them houses.

1:22 and pharaoh charg all hi people, saying, everi son that is
born ye shall cast into the river, and everi daughter ye shall save
alive.

2:1 and there went a man of the hous of levi, and took to wife a
daught of levi.

2:2 and the woman conceived, and bare a son: and when she saw him that
h wa a goodli child, she hid him three months.

2:3 and when she could not longer hide him, she took for him an ark of
bulrushes, and daub it with slime and with pitch, and put the child
therein; and she laid it in the flag by the river' brink.

2:4 and hi sister stood afar off, to wit what would be done to him.

2:5 and the daughter of pharaoh came down to wash herself at the
river; and her maiden walk along by the river' side; and when she
saw the ark among the flags, she sent her maid to fetch it.

2:6 and when she had open it, she saw the child: and, behold, the
bab wept. and she had compass on him, and said, thi is one of the
hebrews' children.

2:7 then said hi sister to pharaoh' daughter, shall I go and call to
the a nurs of the hebrew women, that she may nurs the child for
thee?  2:8 and pharaoh' daughter said to her, go. and the maid went
and call the child' mother.

2:9 and pharaoh' daughter said unto her, take thi child away, and
nurs it for me, and I will give thee thi wages. and the women took
th child, and nurs it.

2:10 and the child grew, and she brought him unto pharaoh' daughter,
and he becam her son. and she call hi name moses: and she said,
becaus I drew him out of the water.

2:11 and it came to pass in those days, when mose wa grown, that he
went out unto hi brethren, and look on their burdens: and he spied
an egyptian smite an hebrew, one of hi brethren.

2:12 and he look thi way and that way, and when he saw that there
wa no man, he slew the egyptian, and hid him in the sand.

2:13 and when he went out the second day, behold, two men of the
hebrew strove together: and he said to him that did the wrong,
wherefor smitest thou thi fellow?  2:14 and he said, who made thee a
princ and a judg over us? intendest thou to kill me, as thou
killedst the egyptian? and mose feared, and said, sure thi thing
i known.

2:15 now when pharaoh heard thi thing, he sought to slay moses. but
mos fled from the face of pharaoh, and dwelt in the land of midian:
and he sat down by a well.

2:16 now the priest of midian had seven daughters: and they came and
drew water, and fill the trough to water their father' flock.

2:17 and the shepherd came and drove them away: but mose stood up
and help them, and water their flock.

2:18 and when they came to reuel their father, he said, how is it that
y are come so soon to day?  2:19 and they said, An egyptian delivered
u out of the hand of the shepherds, and also drew water enough for
us, and water the flock.

2:20 and he said unto hi daughters, and where is he? whi is it that
y have left the man? call him, that he may eat bread.

2:21 and mose wa content to dwell with the man: and he gave moses
zipporah hi daughter.

2:22 and she bare him a son, and he call hi name gershom: for he
said, I have been a stranger in a strang land.

2:23 and it came to pass in process of time, that the king of egypt
died: and the children of israel sigh by reason of the bondage, and
they cried, and their cri came up unto god by reason of the bondage.

2:24 and god heard their groaning, and god rememb hi covenant
with abraham, with isaac, and with jacob.

2:25 and god look upon the children of israel, and god had respect
unto them.

3:1 now mose kept the flock of jethro hi father in law, the priest
of midian: and he led the flock to the backsid of the desert, and
cam to the mountain of god, even to horeb.

3:2 and the angel of the lord appear unto him in a flame of fire out
of the midst of a bush: and he looked, and, behold, the bush burned
with fire, and the bush wa not consumed.

3:3 and mose said, I will now turn aside, and see thi great sight,
whi the bush is not burnt.

3:4 and when the lord saw that he turn asid to see, god call unto
him out of the midst of the bush, and said, moses, moses. and he said,
her am i.

3:5 and he said, draw not nigh hither: put off thi shoe from off thy
feet, for the place whereon thou standest is holi ground.

3:6 moreov he said, I am the god of thi father, the god of abraham,
th god of isaac, and the god of jacob. and mose hid hi face; for he
wa afraid to look upon god.

3:7 and the lord said, I have sure seen the afflict of my people
which are in egypt, and have heard their cri by reason of their
taskmasters; for I know their sorrows; 3:8 and I am come down to
deliv them out of the hand of the egyptians, and to bring them up
out of that land unto a good land and a large, unto a land flowing
with milk and honey; unto the place of the canaanites, and the
hittites, and the amorites, and the perizzites, and the hivites, and
th jebusites.

3:9 now therefore, behold, the cri of the children of israel is come
unto me: and I have also seen the oppress wherewith the egyptians
oppress them.

3:10 come now therefore, and I will send thee unto pharaoh, that thou
mayest bring forth my peopl the children of israel out of egypt.

3:11 and mose said unto god, who am I, that I should go unto pharaoh,
and that I should bring forth the children of israel out of egypt?
3:12 and he said, certainli I will be with thee; and thi shall be a
token unto thee, that I have sent thee: when thou hast brought forth
th peopl out of egypt, ye shall serv god upon thi mountain.

3:13 and mose said unto god, behold, when I come unto the children of
israel, and shall say unto them, the god of your father hath sent me
unto you; and they shall say to me, what is hi name? what shall I say
unto them?  3:14 and god said unto moses, I AM that I am: and he said,
thu shalt thou say unto the children of israel, I AM hath sent me
unto you.

3:15 and god said moreov unto moses, thu shalt thou say unto the
children of israel, the lord god of your fathers, the god of abraham,
th god of isaac, and the god of jacob, hath sent me unto you: thi is
mi name for ever, and thi is my memori unto all generations.

3:16 go, and gather the elder of israel together, and say unto them,
th lord god of your fathers, the god of abraham, of isaac, and of
jacob, appear unto me, saying, I have sure visit you, and seen
that which is done to you in egypt: 3:17 and I have said, I will bring
you up out of the afflict of egypt unto the land of the canaanites,
and the hittites, and the amorites, and the perizzites, and the
hivites, and the jebusites, unto a land flow with milk and honey.

3:18 and they shall hearken to thi voice: and thou shalt come, thou
and the elder of israel, unto the king of egypt, and ye shall say
unto him, the lord god of the hebrew hath met with us: and now let us
go, we beseech thee, three days' journey into the wilderness, that we
may sacrific to the lord our god.

3:19 and I am sure that the king of egypt will not let you go, no, not
bi a mighti hand.

3:20 and I will stretch out my hand, and smite egypt with all my
wond which I will do in the midst thereof: and after that he will
let you go.

3:21 and I will give thi peopl favour in the sight of the egyptians:
and it shall come to pass, that, when ye go, ye shall not go empty.

3:22 but everi woman shall borrow of her neighbour, and of her that
sojourneth in her house, jewel of silver, and jewel of gold, and
raiment: and ye shall put them upon your sons, and upon your
daughters; and ye shall spoil the egyptians.

4:1 and mose answer and said, but, behold, they will not believe
me, nor hearken unto my voice: for they will say, the lord hath not
appear unto thee.

4:2 and the lord said unto him, what is that in thine hand? and he
said, A rod.

4:3 and he said, cast it on the ground. and he cast it on the ground,
and it becam a serpent; and mose fled from befor it.

4:4 and the lord said unto moses, put forth thine hand, and take it by
th tail. and he put forth hi hand, and caught it, and it becam a
rod in hi hand: 4:5 that they may believ that the lord god of their
fathers, the god of abraham, the god of isaac, and the god of jacob,
hath appear unto thee.

4:6 and the lord said furthermor unto him, put now thine hand into
thi bosom. and he put hi hand into hi bosom: and when he took it
out, behold, hi hand wa leprou as snow.

4:7 and he said, put thine hand into thi bosom again. and he put his
hand into hi bosom again; and pluck it out of hi bosom, and,
behold, it wa turn again as hi other flesh.

4:8 and it shall come to pass, if they will not believ thee, neither
hearken to the voic of the first sign, that they will believ the
voic of the latter sign.

4:9 and it shall come to pass, if they will not believ also these two
signs, neither hearken unto thi voice, that thou shalt take of the
wat of the river, and pour it upon the dri land: and the water which
thou takest out of the river shall becom blood upon the dri land.

4:10 and mose said unto the lord, O my lord, I am not eloquent,
neith heretofore, nor sinc thou hast spoken unto thi servant: but i
am slow of speech, and of a slow tongue.

4:11 and the lord said unto him, who hath made man' mouth? or who
maketh the dumb, or deaf, or the seeing, or the blind? have not I the
lord?  4:12 now therefor go, and I will be with thi mouth, and teach
the what thou shalt say.

4:13 and he said, O my lord, send, I pray thee, by the hand of him
whom thou wilt send.

4:14 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against moses, and he said,
i not aaron the levit thi brother? I know that he can speak well.
and also, behold, he cometh forth to meet thee: and when he seeth
thee, he will be glad in hi heart.

4:15 and thou shalt speak unto him, and put word in hi mouth: and i
wil be with thi mouth, and with hi mouth, and will teach you what ye
shal do.

4:16 and he shall be thi spokesman unto the people: and he shall be,
even he shall be to thee instead of a mouth, and thou shalt be to him
instead of god.

4:17 and thou shalt take thi rod in thine hand, wherewith thou shalt
do signs.

4:18 and mose went and return to jethro hi father in law, and said
unto him, let me go, I pray thee, and return unto my brethren which
ar in egypt, and see whether they be yet alive. and jethro said to
moses, Go in peace.

4:19 and the lord said unto mose in midian, go, return into egypt:
for all the men are dead which sought thi life.

4:20 and mose took hi wife and hi sons, and set them upon an ass,
and he return to the land of egypt: and mose took the rod of god in
hi hand.

4:21 and the lord said unto moses, when thou goest to return into
egypt, see that thou do all those wonder befor pharaoh, which I have
put in thine hand: but I will harden hi heart, that he shall not let
th peopl go.

4:22 and thou shalt say unto pharaoh, thu saith the lord, israel is
mi son, even my firstborn: 4:23 and I say unto thee, let my son go,
that he may serv me: and if thou refus to let him go, behold, I will
slay thi son, even thi firstborn.

4:24 and it came to pass by the way in the inn, that the lord met him,
and sought to kill him.

4:25 then zipporah took a sharp stone, and cut off the foreskin of her
son, and cast it at hi feet, and said, sure a bloodi husband art
thou to me.

4:26 So he let him go: then she said, A bloodi husband thou art,
becaus of the circumcision.

4:27 and the lord said to aaron, Go into the wilder to meet moses.
and he went, and met him in the mount of god, and kiss him.

4:28 and mose told aaron all the word of the lord who had sent him,
and all the sign which he had command him.

4:29 and mose and aaron went and gather togeth all the elder of
th children of israel: 4:30 and aaron spake all the word which the
lord had spoken unto moses, and did the sign in the sight of the
people.

4:31 and the peopl believed: and when they heard that the lord had
visit the children of israel, and that he had look upon their
affliction, then they bow their head and worshipped.

5:1 and afterward mose and aaron went in, and told pharaoh, thus
saith the lord god of israel, let my peopl go, that they may hold a
feast unto me in the wilderness.

5:2 and pharaoh said, who is the lord, that I should obey hi voic to
let israel go? I know not the lord, neither will I let israel go.

5:3 and they said, the god of the hebrew hath met with us: let us go,
w pray thee, three days' journey into the desert, and sacrific unto
th lord our god; lest he fall upon us with pestilence, or with the
sword.

5:4 and the king of egypt said unto them, wherefor do ye, mose and
aaron, let the peopl from their works? get you unto your burdens.

5:5 and pharaoh said, behold, the peopl of the land now are many, and
y make them rest from their burdens.

5:6 and pharaoh command the same day the taskmast of the people,
and their officers, saying, 5:7 Ye shall no more give the peopl straw
to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for
themselves.

5:8 and the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye
shal lay upon them; ye shall not diminish ought thereof: for they be
idle; therefor they cry, saying, let us go and sacrific to our god.

5:9 let there more work be laid upon the men, that they may labour
therein; and let them not regard vain words.

5:10 and the taskmast of the peopl went out, and their officers,
and they spake to the people, saying, thu saith pharaoh, I will not
giv you straw.

5:11 Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your
work shall be diminished.

5:12 So the peopl were scatter abroad throughout all the land of
egypt to gather stubbl instead of straw.

5:13 and the taskmast hast them, saying, fulfil your works, your
daili tasks, as when there wa straw.

5:14 and the offic of the children of israel, which pharaoh's
taskmast had set over them, were beaten, and demanded, wherefore
hav ye not fulfil your task in make brick both yesterday and to
day, as heretofore?  5:15 then the offic of the children of israel
cam and cri unto pharaoh, saying, wherefor dealest thou thu with
thi servants?  5:16 there is no straw given unto thi servants, and
they say to us, make brick: and, behold, thi servant are beaten; but
th fault is in thine own people.

5:17 but he said, Ye are idle, ye are idle: therefor ye say, let us
go and do sacrific to the lord.

5:18 Go therefor now, and work; for there shall no straw be given
you, yet shall ye deliv the tale of bricks.

5:19 and the offic of the children of israel did see that they were
in evil case, after it wa said, Ye shall not minish ought from your
brick of your daili task.

5:20 and they met mose and aaron, who stood in the way, as they came
forth from pharaoh: 5:21 and they said unto them, the lord look upon
you, and judge; becaus ye have made our savour to be abhor in the
ey of pharaoh, and in the eye of hi servants, to put a sword in
their hand to slay us.

5:22 and mose return unto the lord, and said, lord, wherefor hast
thou so evil entreat thi people? whi is it that thou hast sent me?
5:23 for sinc I came to pharaoh to speak in thi name, he hath done
evil to thi people; neither hast thou deliv thi peopl at all.

6:1 then the lord said unto moses, now shalt thou see what I will do
to pharaoh: for with a strong hand shall he let them go, and with a
strong hand shall he drive them out of hi land.

6:2 and god spake unto moses, and said unto him, I am the lord: 6:3
and I appear unto abraham, unto isaac, and unto jacob, by the name
of god almighty, but by my name jehovah wa I not known to them.

6:4 and I have also establish my coven with them, to give them
th land of canaan, the land of their pilgrimage, wherein they were
strangers.

6:5 and I have also heard the groan of the children of israel, whom
th egyptian keep in bondage; and I have rememb my covenant.

6:6 wherefor say unto the children of israel, I am the lord, and i
wil bring you out from under the burden of the egyptians, and I will
rid you out of their bondage, and I will redeem you with a stretched
out arm, and with great judgments: 6:7 and I will take you to me for a
people, and I will be to you a god: and ye shall know that I am the
lord your god, which bringeth you out from under the burden of the
egyptians.

6:8 and I will bring you in unto the land, concern the which I did
swear to give it to abraham, to isaac, and to jacob; and I will give
it you for an heritage: I am the lord.

6:9 and mose spake so unto the children of israel: but they hearkened
not unto mose for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.

6:10 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:11 Go in, speak unto
pharaoh king of egypt, that he let the children of israel go out of
hi land.

6:12 and mose spake befor the lord, saying, behold, the children of
israel have not hearken unto me; how then shall pharaoh hear me, who
am of uncircumcis lips?  6:13 and the lord spake unto mose and unto
aaron, and gave them a charg unto the children of israel, and unto
pharaoh king of egypt, to bring the children of israel out of the land
of egypt.

6:14 these be the head of their fathers' houses: the son of reuben
th firstborn of israel; hanoch, and pallu, hezron, and carmi: these
b the famili of reuben.

6:15 and the son of simeon; jemuel, and jamin, and ohad, and jachin,
and zohar, and shaul the son of a canaanitish woman: these are the
famili of simeon.

6:16 and these are the name of the son of levi accord to their
generations; gershon, and kohath, and merari: and the year of the
lif of levi were an hundr thirti and seven years.

6:17 the son of gershon; libni, and shimi, accord to their
families.

6:18 and the son of kohath; amram, and izhar, and hebron, and uzziel:
and the year of the life of kohath were an hundr thirti and three
years.

6:19 and the son of merari; mahali and mushi: these are the families
of levi accord to their generations.

6:20 and amram took him jocheb hi father' sister to wife; and she
bar him aaron and moses: and the year of the life of amram were an
hundr and thirti and seven years.

6:21 and the son of izhar; korah, and nepheg, and zichri.

6:22 and the son of uzziel; mishael, and elzaphan, and zithri.

6:23 and aaron took him elisheba, daughter of amminadab, sister of
naashon, to wife; and she bare him nadab, and abihu, eleazar, and
ithamar.

6:24 and the son of korah; assir, and elkanah, and abiasaph: these
ar the famili of the korhites.

6:25 and eleazar aaron' son took him one of the daughter of putiel
to wife; and she bare him phinehas: these are the head of the fathers
of the levit accord to their families.

6:26 these are that aaron and moses, to whom the lord said, bring out
th children of israel from the land of egypt accord to their
armies.

6:27 these are they which spake to pharaoh king of egypt, to bring out
th children of israel from egypt: these are that mose and aaron.

6:28 and it came to pass on the day when the lord spake unto mose in
th land of egypt, 6:29 that the lord spake unto moses, saying, I am
th lord: speak thou unto pharaoh king of egypt all that I say unto
thee.

6:30 and mose said befor the lord, behold, I am of uncircumcised
lips, and how shall pharaoh hearken unto me?  7:1 and the lord said
unto moses, see, I have made thee a god to pharaoh: and aaron thy
broth shall be thi prophet.

7:2 thou shalt speak all that I command thee: and aaron thi brother
shal speak unto pharaoh, that he send the children of israel out of
hi land.

7:3 and I will harden pharaoh' heart, and multipli my sign and my
wond in the land of egypt.

7:4 but pharaoh shall not hearken unto you, that I may lay my hand
upon egypt, and bring forth mine armies, and my peopl the children of
israel, out of the land of egypt by great judgments.

7:5 and the egyptian shall know that I am the lord, when I stretch
forth mine hand upon egypt, and bring out the children of israel from
among them.

7:6 and mose and aaron did as the lord command them, so did they.

7:7 and mose wa fourscor year old, and aaron fourscor and three
year old, when they spake unto pharaoh.

7:8 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 7:9 when
pharaoh shall speak unto you, saying, shew a miracl for you: then
thou shalt say unto aaron, take thi rod, and cast it befor pharaoh,
and it shall becom a serpent.

7:10 and mose and aaron went in unto pharaoh, and they did so as the
lord had commanded: and aaron cast down hi rod befor pharaoh, and
befor hi servants, and it becam a serpent.

7:11 then pharaoh also call the wise men and the sorcerers: now the
magician of egypt, they also did in like manner with their
enchantments.

7:12 for they cast down everi man hi rod, and they becam serpents:
but aaron' rod swallow up their rods.

7:13 and he harden pharaoh' heart, that he hearken not unto them;
a the lord had said.

7:14 and the lord said unto moses, pharaoh' heart is hardened, he
refuseth to let the peopl go.

7:15 get thee unto pharaoh in the morning; lo, he goeth out unto the
water; and thou shalt stand by the river' brink against he come; and
th rod which wa turn to a serpent shalt thou take in thine hand.

7:16 and thou shalt say unto him, the lord god of the hebrew hath
sent me unto thee, saying, let my peopl go, that they may serv me in
th wilderness: and, behold, hitherto thou wouldest not hear.

7:17 thu saith the lord, In thi thou shalt know that I am the lord:
behold, I will smite with the rod that is in mine hand upon the waters
which are in the river, and they shall be turn to blood.

7:18 and the fish that is in the river shall die, and the river shall
stink; and the egyptian shall loth to drink of the water of the
river.

7:19 and the lord spake unto moses, say unto aaron, take thi rod, and
stretch out thine hand upon the water of egypt, upon their streams,
upon their rivers, and upon their ponds, and upon all their pool of
water, that they may becom blood; and that there may be blood
throughout all the land of egypt, both in vessel of wood, and in
vessel of stone.

7:20 and mose and aaron did so, as the lord commanded; and he lifted
up the rod, and smote the water that were in the river, in the sight
of pharaoh, and in the sight of hi servants; and all the water that
wer in the river were turn to blood.

7:21 and the fish that wa in the river died; and the river stank, and
th egyptian could not drink of the water of the river; and there was
blood throughout all the land of egypt.

7:22 and the magician of egypt did so with their enchantments: and
pharaoh' heart wa hardened, neither did he hearken unto them; as the
lord had said.

7:23 and pharaoh turn and went into hi house, neither did he set
hi heart to thi also.

7:24 and all the egyptian dig round about the river for water to
drink; for they could not drink of the water of the river.

7:25 and seven day were fulfilled, after that the lord had smitten
th river.

8:1 and the lord spake unto moses, Go unto pharaoh, and say unto him,
thu saith the lord, let my peopl go, that they may serv me.

8:2 and if thou refus to let them go, behold, I will smite all thy
bord with frogs: 8:3 and the river shall bring forth frogs
abundantly, which shall go up and come into thine house, and into thy
bedchamber, and upon thi bed, and into the hous of thi servants, and
upon thi people, and into thine ovens, and into thi kneadingtroughs:
8:4 and the frog shall come up both on thee, and upon thi people, and
upon all thi servants.

8:5 and the lord spake unto moses, say unto aaron, stretch forth thine
hand with thi rod over the streams, over the rivers, and over the
ponds, and caus frog to come up upon the land of egypt.

8:6 and aaron stretch out hi hand over the water of egypt; and the
frog came up, and cover the land of egypt.

8:7 and the magician did so with their enchantments, and brought up
frog upon the land of egypt.

8:8 then pharaoh call for mose and aaron, and said, intreat the
lord, that he may take away the frog from me, and from my people; and
i will let the peopl go, that they may do sacrific unto the lord.

8:9 and mose said unto pharaoh, glori over me: when shall I intreat
for thee, and for thi servants, and for thi people, to destroy the
frog from thee and thi houses, that they may remain in the river
only?  8:10 and he said, To morrow. and he said, Be it accord to
thi word: that thou mayest know that there is none like unto the lord
our god.

8:11 and the frog shall depart from thee, and from thi houses, and
from thi servants, and from thi people; they shall remain in the river
only.

8:12 and mose and aaron went out from pharaoh: and mose cri unto
th lord becaus of the frog which he had brought against pharaoh.

8:13 and the lord did accord to the word of moses; and the frogs
di out of the houses, out of the villages, and out of the fields.

8:14 and they gather them togeth upon heaps: and the land stank.

8:15 but when pharaoh saw that there wa respite, he harden his
heart, and hearken not unto them; as the lord had said.

8:16 and the lord said unto moses, say unto aaron, stretch out thy
rod, and smite the dust of the land, that it may becom lice
throughout all the land of egypt.

8:17 and they did so; for aaron stretch out hi hand with hi rod,
and smote the dust of the earth, and it becam lice in man, and in
beast; all the dust of the land becam lice throughout all the land of
egypt.

8:18 and the magician did so with their enchant to bring forth
lice, but they could not: so there were lice upon man, and upon beast.

8:19 then the magician said unto pharaoh, thi is the finger of god:
and pharaoh' heart wa hardened, and he hearken not unto them; as
th lord had said.

8:20 and the lord said unto moses, rise up earli in the morning, and
stand befor pharaoh; lo, he cometh forth to the water; and say unto
him, thu saith the lord, let my peopl go, that they may serv me.

8:21 else, if thou wilt not let my peopl go, behold, I will send
swarm of fli upon thee, and upon thi servants, and upon thi people,
and into thi houses: and the hous of the egyptian shall be full of
swarm of flies, and also the ground whereon they are.

8:22 and I will sever in that day the land of goshen, in which my
peopl dwell, that no swarm of fli shall be there; to the end thou
mayest know that I am the lord in the midst of the earth.

8:23 and I will put a divis between my peopl and thi people: to
morrow shall thi sign be.

8:24 and the lord did so; and there came a grievou swarm of flies
into the hous of pharaoh, and into hi servants' houses, and into all
th land of egypt: the land wa corrupt by reason of the swarm of
flies.

8:25 and pharaoh call for mose and for aaron, and said, Go ye,
sacrific to your god in the land.

8:26 and mose said, It is not meet so to do; for we shall sacrifice
th abomin of the egyptian to the lord our god: lo, shall we
sacrific the abomin of the egyptian befor their eyes, and will
they not stone us?  8:27 We will go three days' journey into the
wilderness, and sacrific to the lord our god, as he shall command us.

8:28 and pharaoh said, I will let you go, that ye may sacrific to the
lord your god in the wilderness; onli ye shall not go veri far away:
intreat for me.

8:29 and mose said, behold, I go out from thee, and I will intreat
th lord that the swarm of fli may depart from pharaoh, from his
servants, and from hi people, to morrow: but let not pharaoh deal
deceit ani more in not let the peopl go to sacrific to the
lord.

8:30 and mose went out from pharaoh, and intreat the lord.

8:31 and the lord did accord to the word of moses; and he removed
th swarm of fli from pharaoh, from hi servants, and from his
people; there remain not one.

8:32 and pharaoh harden hi heart at thi time also, neither would
h let the peopl go.

9:1 then the lord said unto moses, Go in unto pharaoh, and tell him,
thu saith the lord god of the hebrews, let my peopl go, that they
may serv me.

9:2 for if thou refus to let them go, and wilt hold them still, 9:3
behold, the hand of the lord is upon thi cattl which is in the field,
upon the horses, upon the asses, upon the camels, upon the oxen, and
upon the sheep: there shall be a veri grievou murrain.

9:4 and the lord shall sever between the cattl of israel and the
cattl of egypt: and there shall noth die of all that is the
children' of israel.

9:5 and the lord appoint a set time, saying, To morrow the lord
shal do thi thing in the land.

9:6 and the lord did that thing on the morrow, and all the cattl of
egypt died: but of the cattl of the children of israel die not one.

9:7 and pharaoh sent, and, behold, there wa not one of the cattl of
th israelit dead. and the heart of pharaoh wa hardened, and he did
not let the peopl go.

9:8 and the lord said unto mose and unto aaron, take to you handfuls
of ash of the furnace, and let mose sprinkl it toward the heaven
in the sight of pharaoh.

9:9 and it shall becom small dust in all the land of egypt, and shall
b a boil break forth with blain upon man, and upon beast,
throughout all the land of egypt.

9:10 and they took ash of the furnace, and stood befor pharaoh; and
mos sprinkl it up toward heaven; and it becam a boil breaking
forth with blain upon man, and upon beast.

9:11 and the magician could not stand befor mose becaus of the
boils; for the boil wa upon the magicians, and upon all the
egyptians.

9:12 and the lord harden the heart of pharaoh, and he hearken not
unto them; as the lord had spoken unto moses.

9:13 and the lord said unto moses, rise up earli in the morning, and
stand befor pharaoh, and say unto him, thu saith the lord god of the
hebrews, let my peopl go, that they may serv me.

9:14 for I will at thi time send all my plagu upon thine heart, and
upon thi servants, and upon thi people; that thou mayest know that
ther is none like me in all the earth.

9:15 for now I will stretch out my hand, that I may smite thee and thy
peopl with pestilence; and thou shalt be cut off from the earth.

9:16 and in veri deed for thi caus have I rais thee up, for to
shew in thee my power; and that my name may be declar throughout all
th earth.

9:17 As yet exaltest thou thyself against my people, that thou wilt
not let them go?  9:18 behold, to morrow about thi time I will cause
it to rain a veri grievou hail, such as hath not been in egypt since
th foundat thereof even until now.

9:19 send therefor now, and gather thi cattle, and all that thou hast
in the field; for upon everi man and beast which shall be found in the
field, and shall not be brought home, the hail shall come down upon
them, and they shall die.

9:20 He that fear the word of the lord among the servant of pharaoh
mad hi servant and hi cattl flee into the houses: 9:21 and he
that regard not the word of the lord left hi servant and his
cattl in the field.

9:22 and the lord said unto moses, stretch forth thine hand toward
heaven, that there may be hail in all the land of egypt, upon man, and
upon beast, and upon everi herb of the field, throughout the land of
egypt.

9:23 and mose stretch forth hi rod toward heaven: and the lord
sent thunder and hail, and the fire ran along upon the ground; and the
lord rain hail upon the land of egypt.

9:24 So there wa hail, and fire mingl with the hail, veri grievous,
such as there wa none like it in all the land of egypt sinc it
becam a nation.

9:25 and the hail smote throughout all the land of egypt all that was
in the field, both man and beast; and the hail smote everi herb of the
field, and brake everi tree of the field.

9:26 onli in the land of goshen, where the children of israel were,
wa there no hail.

9:27 and pharaoh sent, and call for mose and aaron, and said unto
them, I have sin thi time: the lord is righteous, and I and my
peopl are wicked.

9:28 intreat the lord (for it is enough) that there be no more mighty
thund and hail; and I will let you go, and ye shall stay no
longer.

9:29 and mose said unto him, As soon as I am gone out of the city, i
wil spread abroad my hand unto the lord; and the thunder shall
cease, neither shall there be ani more hail; that thou mayest know how
that the earth is the lord's.

9:30 but as for thee and thi servants, I know that ye will not yet
fear the lord god.

9:31 and the flax and the barley wa smitten: for the barley wa in
th ear, and the flax wa bolled.

9:32 but the wheat and the rie were not smitten: for they were not
grown up.

9:33 and mose went out of the citi from pharaoh, and spread abroad
hi hand unto the lord: and the thunder and hail ceased, and the
rain wa not pour upon the earth.

9:34 and when pharaoh saw that the rain and the hail and the thunders
wer ceased, he sin yet more, and harden hi heart, he and his
servants.

9:35 and the heart of pharaoh wa hardened, neither would he let the
children of israel go; as the lord had spoken by moses.

10:1 and the lord said unto moses, Go in unto pharaoh: for I have
harden hi heart, and the heart of hi servants, that I might shew
thes my sign befor him: 10:2 and that thou mayest tell in the ears
of thi son, and of thi son' son, what thing I have wrought in egypt,
and my sign which I have done among them; that ye may know how that i
am the lord.

10:3 and mose and aaron came in unto pharaoh, and said unto him, thus
saith the lord god of the hebrews, how long wilt thou refus to humble
thyself befor me? let my peopl go, that they may serv me.

10:4 else, if thou refus to let my peopl go, behold, to morrow will
i bring the locust into thi coast: 10:5 and they shall cover the face
of the earth, that one cannot be abl to see the earth: and they shall
eat the residu of that which is escaped, which remaineth unto you
from the hail, and shall eat everi tree which groweth for you out of
th field: 10:6 and they shall fill thi houses, and the hous of all
thi servants, and the hous of all the egyptians; which neither thy
fathers, nor thi fathers' father have seen, sinc the day that they
wer upon the earth unto thi day. and he turn himself, and went out
from pharaoh.

10:7 and pharaoh' servant said unto him, how long shall thi man be
a snare unto us? let the men go, that they may serv the lord their
god: knowest thou not yet that egypt is destroyed?  10:8 and mose and
aaron were brought again unto pharaoh: and he said unto them, go,
serv the lord your god: but who are they that shall go?  10:9 and
mos said, We will go with our young and with our old, with our sons
and with our daughters, with our flock and with our herd will we go;
for we must hold a feast unto the lord.

10:10 and he said unto them, let the lord be so with you, as I will
let you go, and your littl ones: look to it; for evil is befor you.

10:11 not so: go now ye that are men, and serv the lord; for that ye
did desire. and they were driven out from pharaoh' presence.

10:12 and the lord said unto moses, stretch out thine hand over the
land of egypt for the locusts, that they may come up upon the land of
egypt, and eat everi herb of the land, even all that the hail hath
left.

10:13 and mose stretch forth hi rod over the land of egypt, and
th lord brought an east wind upon the land all that day, and all that
night; and when it wa morning, the east wind brought the locusts.

10:14 and the locust went up over all the land of egypt, and rest in
al the coast of egypt: veri grievou were they; befor them there
wer no such locust as they, neither after them shall be such.

10:15 for they cover the face of the whole earth, so that the land
wa darkened; and they did eat everi herb of the land, and all the
fruit of the tree which the hail had left: and there remain not any
green thing in the trees, or in the herb of the field, through all
th land of egypt.

10:16 then pharaoh call for mose and aaron in haste; and he said, i
hav sin against the lord your god, and against you.

10:17 now therefor forgive, I pray thee, my sin onli thi once, and
intreat the lord your god, that he may take away from me thi death
only.

10:18 and he went out from pharaoh, and intreat the lord.

10:19 and the lord turn a mighti strong west wind, which took away
th locusts, and cast them into the red sea; there remain not one
locust in all the coast of egypt.

10:20 but the lord harden pharaoh' heart, so that he would not let
th children of israel go.

10:21 and the lord said unto moses, stretch out thine hand toward
heaven, that there may be dark over the land of egypt, even
dark which may be felt.

10:22 and mose stretch forth hi hand toward heaven; and there was
a thick dark in all the land of egypt three days: 10:23 they saw
not one another, neither rose ani from hi place for three days: but
al the children of israel had light in their dwellings.

10:24 and pharaoh call unto moses, and said, Go ye, serv the lord;
onli let your flock and your herd be stayed: let your littl ones
also go with you.

10:25 and mose said, thou must give us also sacrific and burnt
offerings, that we may sacrific unto the lord our god.

10:26 our cattl also shall go with us; there shall not an hoof be
left behind; for thereof must we take to serv the lord our god; and
