w know not with what we must serv the lord, until we come thither.

10:27 but the lord harden pharaoh' heart, and he would not let them
go.

10:28 and pharaoh said unto him, get thee from me, take heed to
thyself, see my face no more; for in that day thou seest my face thou
shalt die.

10:29 and mose said, thou hast spoken well, I will see thi face again
no more.

11:1 and the lord said unto moses, yet will I bring one plagu more
upon pharaoh, and upon egypt; afterward he will let you go hence:
when he shall let you go, he shall sure thrust you out hence
altogether.

11:2 speak now in the ear of the people, and let everi man borrow of
hi neighbour, and everi woman of her neighbour, jewel of silver and
jewel of gold.

11:3 and the lord gave the peopl favour in the sight of the
egyptians.

moreov the man mose wa veri great in the land of egypt, in the
sight of pharaoh' servants, and in the sight of the people.

11:4 and mose said, thu saith the lord, about midnight will I go out
into the midst of egypt: 11:5 and all the firstborn in the land of
egypt shall die, from the first born of pharaoh that sitteth upon his
throne, even unto the firstborn of the maidserv that is behind the
mill; and all the firstborn of beasts.

11:6 and there shall be a great cri throughout all the land of egypt,
such as there wa none like it, nor shall be like it ani more.

11:7 but against ani of the children of israel shall not a dog move
hi tongue, against man or beast: that ye may know how that the lord
doth put a differ between the egyptian and israel.

11:8 and all these thi servant shall come down unto me, and bow down
themselv unto me, saying, get thee out, and all the peopl that
follow thee: and after that I will go out. and he went out from
pharaoh in a great anger.

11:9 and the lord said unto moses, pharaoh shall not hearken unto you;
that my wonder may be multipli in the land of egypt.

11:10 and mose and aaron did all these wonder befor pharaoh: and
th lord harden pharaoh' heart, so that he would not let the
children of israel go out of hi land.

12:1 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron in the land of egypt
saying, 12:2 thi month shall be unto you the begin of months: it
shal be the first month of the year to you.

12:3 speak ye unto all the congreg of israel, saying, In the
tenth day of thi month they shall take to them everi man a lamb,
accord to the hous of their fathers, a lamb for an house: 12:4 and
if the household be too littl for the lamb, let him and hi neighbour
next unto hi hous take it accord to the number of the souls;
everi man accord to hi eat shall make your count for the lamb.

12:5 your lamb shall be without blemish, a male of the first year: ye
shal take it out from the sheep, or from the goats: 12:6 and ye shall
keep it up until the fourteenth day of the same month: and the whole
assembl of the congreg of israel shall kill it in the evening.

12:7 and they shall take of the blood, and strike it on the two side
post and on the upper door post of the houses, wherein they shall eat
it.

12:8 and they shall eat the flesh in that night, roast with fire, and
unleaven bread; and with bitter herb they shall eat it.

12:9 eat not of it raw, nor sodden at all with water, but roast with
fire; hi head with hi legs, and with the purten thereof.

12:10 and ye shall let noth of it remain until the morning; and
that which remaineth of it until the morn ye shall burn with fire.

12:11 and thu shall ye eat it; with your loin girded, your shoe on
your feet, and your staff in your hand; and ye shall eat it in haste:
it is the lord' passover.

12:12 for I will pass through the land of egypt thi night, and will
smit all the firstborn in the land of egypt, both man and beast; and
against all the god of egypt I will execut judgment: I am the lord.

12:13 and the blood shall be to you for a token upon the hous where
y are: and when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and the plague
shal not be upon you to destroy you, when I smite the land of egypt.

12:14 and thi day shall be unto you for a memorial; and ye shall keep
it a feast to the lord throughout your generations; ye shall keep it a
feast by an ordin for ever.

12:15 seven day shall ye eat unleaven bread; even the first day ye
shal put away leaven out of your houses: for whosoev eateth
leaven bread from the first day until the seventh day, that soul
shal be cut off from israel.

12:16 and in the first day there shall be an holi convocation, and in
th seventh day there shall be an holi convoc to you; no manner
of work shall be done in them, save that which everi man must eat,
that onli may be done of you.

12:17 and ye shall observ the feast of unleaven bread; for in this
selfsam day have I brought your armi out of the land of egypt:
therefor shall ye observ thi day in your gener by an
ordin for ever.

12:18 In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month at even,
y shall eat unleaven bread, until the one and twentieth day of the
month at even.

12:19 seven day shall there be no leaven found in your houses: for
whosoev eateth that which is leavened, even that soul shall be cut
off from the congreg of israel, whether he be a stranger, or born
in the land.

12:20 Ye shall eat noth leavened; in all your habit shall ye
eat unleaven bread.

12:21 then mose call for all the elder of israel, and said unto
them, draw out and take you a lamb accord to your families, and
kil the passover.

12:22 and ye shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood
that is in the bason, and strike the lintel and the two side posts
with the blood that is in the bason; and none of you shall go out at
th door of hi hous until the morning.

12:23 for the lord will pass through to smite the egyptians; and when
h seeth the blood upon the lintel, and on the two side posts, the
lord will pass over the door, and will not suffer the destroy to
com in unto your hous to smite you.

12:24 and ye shall observ thi thing for an ordin to thee and to
thi son for ever.

12:25 and it shall come to pass, when ye be come to the land which the
lord will give you, accord as he hath promised, that ye shall keep
thi service.

12:26 and it shall come to pass, when your children shall say unto
you, what mean ye by thi service?  12:27 that ye shall say, It is the
sacrific of the lord' passover, who pass over the hous of the
children of israel in egypt, when he smote the egyptians, and
deliv our houses. and the peopl bow the head and worshipped.

12:28 and the children of israel went away, and did as the lord had
command mose and aaron, so did they.

12:29 and it came to pass, that at midnight the lord smote all the
firstborn in the land of egypt, from the firstborn of pharaoh that sat
on hi throne unto the firstborn of the captiv that wa in the
dungeon; and all the firstborn of cattle.

12:30 and pharaoh rose up in the night, he, and all hi servants, and
al the egyptians; and there wa a great cri in egypt; for there was
not a hous where there wa not one dead.

12:31 and he call for mose and aaron by night, and said, rise up,
and get you forth from among my people, both ye and the children of
israel; and go, serv the lord, as ye have said.

12:32 also take your flock and your herds, as ye have said, and be
gone; and bless me also.

12:33 and the egyptian were urgent upon the people, that they might
send them out of the land in haste; for they said, We be all dead men.

12:34 and the peopl took their dough befor it wa leavened, their
kneadingtrough be bound up in their cloth upon their shoulders.

12:35 and the children of israel did accord to the word of moses;
and they borrow of the egyptian jewel of silver, and jewel of
gold, and raiment: 12:36 and the lord gave the peopl favour in the
sight of the egyptians, so that they lent unto them such thing as
they required. and they spoil the egyptians.

12:37 and the children of israel journey from rames to succoth,
about six hundr thousand on foot that were men, besid children.

12:38 and a mix multitud went up also with them; and flocks, and
herds, even veri much cattle.

12:39 and they bake unleaven cake of the dough which they brought
forth out of egypt, for it wa not leavened; becaus they were thrust
out of egypt, and could not tarry, neither had they prepar for
themselv ani victual.

12:40 now the sojourn of the children of israel, who dwelt in
egypt, wa four hundr and thirti years.

12:41 and it came to pass at the end of the four hundr and thirty
years, even the selfsam day it came to pass, that all the host of
th lord went out from the land of egypt.

12:42 It is a night to be much observ unto the lord for bringing
them out from the land of egypt: thi is that night of the lord to be
observ of all the children of israel in their generations.

12:43 and the lord said unto mose and aaron, thi is the ordin of
th passover: there shall no stranger eat thereof: 12:44 but every
man' servant that is bought for money, when thou hast circumcised
him, then shall he eat thereof.

12:45 A foreign and an hire servant shall not eat thereof.

12:46 In one hous shall it be eaten; thou shalt not carri forth ought
of the flesh abroad out of the house; neither shall ye break a bone
thereof.

12:47 all the congreg of israel shall keep it.

12:48 and when a stranger shall sojourn with thee, and will keep the
passov to the lord, let all hi male be circumcised, and then let
him come near and keep it; and he shall be as one that is born in the
land: for no uncircumcis person shall eat thereof.

12:49 one law shall be to him that is homeborn, and unto the stranger
that sojourneth among you.

12:50 thu did all the children of israel; as the lord command moses
and aaron, so did they.

12:51 and it came to pass the selfsam day, that the lord did bring
th children of israel out of the land of egypt by their armies.

13:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 13:2 sanctifi unto me all
th firstborn, whatsoev openeth the womb among the children of
israel, both of man and of beast: it is mine.

13:3 and mose said unto the people, rememb thi day, in which ye
cam out from egypt, out of the hous of bondage; for by strength of
hand the lord brought you out from thi place: there shall no leavened
bread be eaten.

13:4 thi day came ye out in the month abib.

13:5 and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of
th canaanites, and the hittites, and the amorites, and the hivites,
and the jebusites, which he sware unto thi father to give thee, a
land flow with milk and honey, that thou shalt keep thi servic in
thi month.

13:6 seven day thou shalt eat unleaven bread, and in the seventh
day shall be a feast to the lord.

13:7 unleaven bread shall be eaten seven days; and there shall no
leaven bread be seen with thee, neither shall there be leaven seen
with thee in all thi quarters.

13:8 and thou shalt shew thi son in that day, saying, thi is done
becaus of that which the lord did unto me when I came forth out of
egypt.

13:9 and it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a
memori between thine eyes, that the lord' law may be in thi mouth:
for with a strong hand hath the lord brought thee out of egypt.

13:10 thou shalt therefor keep thi ordin in hi season from year
to year.

13:11 and it shall be when the lord shall bring thee into the land of
th canaanites, as he sware unto thee and to thi fathers, and shall
giv it thee, 13:12 that thou shalt set apart unto the lord all that
openeth the matrix, and everi firstl that cometh of a beast which
thou hast; the male shall be the lord's.

13:13 and everi firstl of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb; and
if thou wilt not redeem it, then thou shalt break hi neck: and all
th firstborn of man among thi children shalt thou redeem.

13:14 and it shall be when thi son asketh thee in time to come,
saying, what is this? that thou shalt say unto him, By strength of
hand the lord brought us out from egypt, from the hous of bondage:
13:15 and it came to pass, when pharaoh would hardli let us go, that
th lord slew all the firstborn in the land of egypt, both the
firstborn of man, and the firstborn of beast: therefor I sacrific to
th lord all that openeth the matrix, be males; but all the
firstborn of my children I redeem.

13:16 and it shall be for a token upon thine hand, and for frontlets
between thine eyes: for by strength of hand the lord brought us forth
out of egypt.

13:17 and it came to pass, when pharaoh had let the peopl go, that
god led them not through the way of the land of the philistines,
although that wa near; for god said, lest peradventur the people
rep when they see war, and they return to egypt: 13:18 but god led
th peopl about, through the way of the wilder of the red sea:
and the children of israel went up har out of the land of egypt.

13:19 and mose took the bone of joseph with him: for he had straitly
sworn the children of israel, saying, god will sure visit you; and
y shall carri up my bone away henc with you.

13:20 and they took their journey from succoth, and encamp in etham,
in the edg of the wilderness.

13:21 and the lord went befor them by day in a pillar of a cloud, to
lead them the way; and by night in a pillar of fire, to give them
light; to go by day and night: 13:22 He took not away the pillar of
th cloud by day, nor the pillar of fire by night, from befor the
people.

14:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 14:2 speak unto the
children of israel, that they turn and encamp befor pihahiroth,
between migdol and the sea, over against baalzephon: befor it shall
y encamp by the sea.

14:3 for pharaoh will say of the children of israel, they are
entangl in the land, the wilder hath shut them in.

14:4 and I will harden pharaoh' heart, that he shall follow after
them; and I will be honour upon pharaoh, and upon all hi host; that
th egyptian may know that I am the lord. and they did so.

14:5 and it wa told the king of egypt that the peopl fled: and the
heart of pharaoh and of hi servant wa turn against the people,
and they said, whi have we done this, that we have let israel go from
serv us?  14:6 and he made readi hi chariot, and took hi people
with him: 14:7 and he took six hundr chosen chariots, and all the
chariot of egypt, and captain over everi one of them.

14:8 and the lord harden the heart of pharaoh king of egypt, and he
pursu after the children of israel: and the children of israel went
out with an high hand.

14:9 but the egyptian pursu after them, all the hors and chariots
of pharaoh, and hi horsemen, and hi army, and overtook them
encamp by the sea, besid pihahiroth, befor baalzephon.

14:10 and when pharaoh drew nigh, the children of israel lift up
their eyes, and, behold, the egyptian march after them; and they
wer sore afraid: and the children of israel cri out unto the lord.

14:11 and they said unto moses, becaus there were no grave in egypt,
hast thou taken us away to die in the wilderness? wherefor hast thou
dealt thu with us, to carri us forth out of egypt?  14:12 Is not this
th word that we did tell thee in egypt, saying, let us alone, that we
may serv the egyptians? for it had been better for us to serv the
egyptians, than that we should die in the wilderness.

14:13 and mose said unto the people, fear ye not, stand still, and
se the salvat of the lord, which he will shew to you to day: for
th egyptian whom ye have seen to day, ye shall see them again no
mor for ever.

14:14 the lord shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.

14:15 and the lord said unto moses, wherefor criest thou unto me?
speak unto the children of israel, that they go forward: 14:16 but
lift thou up thi rod, and stretch out thine hand over the sea, and
divid it: and the children of israel shall go on dri ground through
th midst of the sea.

14:17 and I, behold, I will harden the heart of the egyptians, and
they shall follow them: and I will get me honour upon pharaoh, and
upon all hi host, upon hi chariots, and upon hi horsemen.

14:18 and the egyptian shall know that I am the lord, when I have
gotten me honour upon pharaoh, upon hi chariots, and upon his
horsemen.

14:19 and the angel of god, which went befor the camp of israel,
remov and went behind them; and the pillar of the cloud went from
befor their face, and stood behind them: 14:20 and it came between
th camp of the egyptian and the camp of israel; and it wa a cloud
and dark to them, but it gave light by night to these: so that the
on came not near the other all the night.

14:21 and mose stretch out hi hand over the sea; and the lord
caus the sea to go back by a strong east wind all that night, and
mad the sea dri land, and the water were divided.

14:22 and the children of israel went into the midst of the sea upon
th dri ground: and the water were a wall unto them on their right
hand, and on their left.

14:23 and the egyptian pursued, and went in after them to the midst
of the sea, even all pharaoh' horses, hi chariots, and hi horsemen.

14:24 and it came to pass, that in the morn watch the lord looked
unto the host of the egyptian through the pillar of fire and of the
cloud, and troubl the host of the egyptians, 14:25 and took off
their chariot wheels, that they drave them heavily: so that the
egyptian said, let us flee from the face of israel; for the lord
fighteth for them against the egyptians.

14:26 and the lord said unto moses, stretch out thine hand over the
sea, that the water may come again upon the egyptians, upon their
chariots, and upon their horsemen.

14:27 and mose stretch forth hi hand over the sea, and the sea
return to hi strength when the morn appeared; and the egyptians
fl against it; and the lord overthrew the egyptian in the midst of
th sea.

14:28 and the water returned, and cover the chariots, and the
horsemen, and all the host of pharaoh that came into the sea after
them; there remain not so much as one of them.

14:29 but the children of israel walk upon dri land in the midst of
th sea; and the water were a wall unto them on their right hand, and
on their left.

14:30 thu the lord save israel that day out of the hand of the
egyptians; and israel saw the egyptian dead upon the sea shore.

14:31 and israel saw that great work which the lord did upon the
egyptians: and the peopl fear the lord, and believ the lord, and
hi servant moses.

15:1 then sang mose and the children of israel thi song unto the
lord, and spake, saying, I will sing unto the lord, for he hath
triumph gloriously: the hors and hi rider hath he thrown into the
sea.

15:2 the lord is my strength and song, and he is becom my salvation:
h is my god, and I will prepar him an habitation; my father' god,
and I will exalt him.

15:3 the lord is a man of war: the lord is hi name.

15:4 pharaoh' chariot and hi host hath he cast into the sea: his
chosen captain also are drown in the red sea.

15:5 the depth have cover them: they sank into the bottom as a
stone.

15:6 thi right hand, O lord, is becom gloriou in power: thi right
hand, O lord, hath dash in piec the enemy.

15:7 and in the great of thine excel thou hast overthrown
them that rose up against thee: thou sentest forth thi wrath, which
consum them as stubble.

15:8 and with the blast of thi nostril the water were gathered
together, the flood stood upright as an heap, and the depth were
cong in the heart of the sea.

15:9 the enemi said, I will pursue, I will overtake, I will divid the
spoil; my lust shall be satisfi upon them; I will draw my sword, my
hand shall destroy them.

15:10 thou didst blow with thi wind, the sea cover them: they sank
a lead in the mighti waters.

15:11 who is like unto thee, O lord, among the gods? who is like thee,
glori in holiness, fear in praises, do wonders?  15:12 thou
stretchedst out thi right hand, the earth swallow them.

15:13 thou in thi merci hast led forth the peopl which thou hast
redeemed: thou hast guid them in thi strength unto thi holy
habitation.

15:14 the peopl shall hear, and be afraid: sorrow shall take hold on
th inhabit of palestina.

15:15 then the duke of edom shall be amazed; the mighti men of moab,
trembl shall take hold upon them; all the inhabit of canaan
shal melt away.

15:16 fear and dread shall fall upon them; by the great of thine
arm they shall be as still as a stone; till thi peopl pass over, o
lord, till the peopl pass over, which thou hast purchased.

15:17 thou shalt bring them in, and plant them in the mountain of
thin inheritance, in the place, O lord, which thou hast made for thee
to dwell in, in the sanctuary, O lord, which thi hand have
established.

15:18 the lord shall reign for ever and ever.

15:19 for the hors of pharaoh went in with hi chariot and with his
horsemen into the sea, and the lord brought again the water of the
sea upon them; but the children of israel went on dri land in the
midst of the sea.

15:20 and miriam the prophetess, the sister of aaron, took a timbrel
in her hand; and all the women went out after her with timbrel and
with dances.

15:21 and miriam answer them, sing ye to the lord, for he hath
triumph gloriously; the hors and hi rider hath he thrown into the
sea.

15:22 So mose brought israel from the red sea, and they went out into
th wilder of shur; and they went three day in the wilderness,
and found no water.

15:23 and when they came to marah, they could not drink of the waters
of marah, for they were bitter: therefor the name of it wa called
marah.

15:24 and the peopl murmur against moses, saying, what shall we
drink?  15:25 and he cri unto the lord; and the lord shew him a
tree, which when he had cast into the waters, the water were made
sweet: there he made for them a statut and an ordinance, and there he
prov them, 15:26 and said, If thou wilt dilig hearken to the
voic of the lord thi god, and wilt do that which is right in his
sight, and wilt give ear to hi commandments, and keep all his
statutes, I will put none of these diseas upon thee, which I have
brought upon the egyptians: for I am the lord that healeth thee.

15:27 and they came to elim, where were twelv well of water, and
threescor and ten palm trees: and they encamp there by the waters.

16:1 and they took their journey from elim, and all the congregation
of the children of israel came unto the wilder of sin, which is
between elim and sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after
their depart out of the land of egypt.

16:2 and the whole congreg of the children of israel murmured
against mose and aaron in the wilderness: 16:3 and the children of
israel said unto them, would to god we had die by the hand of the
lord in the land of egypt, when we sat by the flesh pots, and when we
did eat bread to the full; for ye have brought us forth into this
wilderness, to kill thi whole assembl with hunger.

16:4 then said the lord unto moses, behold, I will rain bread from
heaven for you; and the peopl shall go out and gather a certain rate
everi day, that I may prove them, whether they will walk in my law, or
no.

16:5 and it shall come to pass, that on the sixth day they shall
prepar that which they bring in; and it shall be twice as much as
they gather daily.

16:6 and mose and aaron said unto all the children of israel, at
even, then ye shall know that the lord hath brought you out from the
land of egypt: 16:7 and in the morning, then ye shall see the glori of
th lord; for that he heareth your murmur against the lord: and
what are we, that ye murmur against us?  16:8 and mose said, this
shal be, when the lord shall give you in the even flesh to eat,
and in the morn bread to the full; for that the lord heareth your
murmur which ye murmur against him: and what are we? your
murmur are not against us, but against the lord.

16:9 and mose spake unto aaron, say unto all the congreg of the
children of israel, come near befor the lord: for he hath heard your
murmurings.

16:10 and it came to pass, as aaron spake unto the whole congregation
of the children of israel, that they look toward the wilderness,
and, behold, the glori of the lord appear in the cloud.

16:11 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 16:12 I have heard the
murmur of the children of israel: speak unto them, saying, At even
y shall eat flesh, and in the morn ye shall be fill with bread;
and ye shall know that I am the lord your god.

16:13 and it came to pass, that at even the quail came up, and
cov the camp: and in the morn the dew lay round about the host.

16:14 and when the dew that lay wa gone up, behold, upon the face of
th wilder there lay a small round thing, as small as the hoar
frost on the ground.

16:15 and when the children of israel saw it, they said one to
another, It is manna: for they wist not what it was. and mose said
unto them, thi is the bread which the lord hath given you to eat.

16:16 thi is the thing which the lord hath commanded, gather of it
everi man accord to hi eating, an omer for everi man, accord to
th number of your persons; take ye everi man for them which are in
hi tents.

16:17 and the children of israel did so, and gathered, some more, some
less.

16:18 and when they did mete it with an omer, he that gather much
had noth over, and he that gather littl had no lack; they
gath everi man accord to hi eating.

16:19 and mose said, let no man leav of it till the morning.

16:20 notwithstand they hearken not unto moses; but some of them
left of it until the morning, and it bred worms, and stank: and moses
wa wroth with them.

16:21 and they gather it everi morning, everi man accord to his
eating: and when the sun wax hot, it melted.

16:22 and it came to pass, that on the sixth day they gather twice
a much bread, two omer for one man: and all the ruler of the
congreg came and told moses.

16:23 and he said unto them, thi is that which the lord hath said, to
morrow is the rest of the holi sabbath unto the lord: bake that which
y will bake to day, and seeth that ye will seethe; and that which
remaineth over lay up for you to be kept until the morning.

16:24 and they laid it up till the morning, as mose bade: and it did
not stink, neither wa there ani worm therein.

16:25 and mose said, eat that to day; for to day is a sabbath unto
th lord: to day ye shall not find it in the field.

16:26 six day ye shall gather it; but on the seventh day, which is
th sabbath, in it there shall be none.

16:27 and it came to pass, that there went out some of the peopl on
th seventh day for to gather, and they found none.

16:28 and the lord said unto moses, how long refus ye to keep my
command and my laws?  16:29 see, for that the lord hath given you
th sabbath, therefor he giveth you on the sixth day the bread of two
days; abid ye everi man in hi place, let no man go out of hi place
on the seventh day.

16:30 So the peopl rest on the seventh day.

16:31 and the hous of israel call the name thereof manna: and it
wa like coriand seed, white; and the tast of it wa like wafers
mad with honey.

16:32 and mose said, thi is the thing which the lord commandeth,
fil an omer of it to be kept for your generations; that they may see
th bread wherewith I have fed you in the wilderness, when I brought
you forth from the land of egypt.

16:33 and mose said unto aaron, take a pot, and put an omer full of
manna therein, and lay it up befor the lord, to be kept for your
generations.

16:34 As the lord command moses, so aaron laid it up befor the
testimony, to be kept.

16:35 and the children of israel did eat manna forti years, until they
cam to a land inhabited; they did eat manna, until they came unto the
bord of the land of canaan.

16:36 now an omer is the tenth part of an ephah.

17:1 and all the congreg of the children of israel journey from
th wilder of sin, after their journeys, accord to the
command of the lord, and pitch in rephidim: and there wa no
wat for the peopl to drink.

17:2 wherefor the peopl did chide with moses, and said, give us
wat that we may drink. and mose said unto them, whi chide ye with
me? wherefor do ye tempt the lord?  17:3 and the peopl thirsted
ther for water; and the peopl murmur against moses, and said,
wherefor is thi that thou hast brought us up out of egypt, to kill
u and our children and our cattl with thirst?  17:4 and mose cried
unto the lord, saying, what shall I do unto thi people? they be
almost readi to stone me.

17:5 and the lord said unto moses, Go on befor the people, and take
with thee of the elder of israel; and thi rod, wherewith thou smotest
th river, take in thine hand, and go.

17:6 behold, I will stand befor thee there upon the rock in horeb;
and thou shalt smite the rock, and there shall come water out of it,
that the peopl may drink. and mose did so in the sight of the elders
of israel.

17:7 and he call the name of the place massah, and meribah, because
of the chide of the children of israel, and becaus they tempt the
lord, saying, Is the lord among us, or not?  17:8 then came amalek,
and fought with israel in rephidim.

17:9 and mose said unto joshua, choos us out men, and go out, fight
with amalek: to morrow I will stand on the top of the hill with the
rod of god in mine hand.

17:10 So joshua did as mose had said to him, and fought with amalek:
and moses, aaron, and hur went up to the top of the hill.

17:11 and it came to pass, when mose held up hi hand, that israel
prevailed: and when he let down hi hand, amalek prevailed.

17:12 but mose hand were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it
und him, and he sat thereon; and aaron and hur stay up hi hands,
th one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his
hand were steadi until the go down of the sun.

17:13 and joshua discomfit amalek and hi peopl with the edg of
th sword.

17:14 and the lord said unto moses, write thi for a memori in a
book, and rehears it in the ear of joshua: for I will utterli put
out the remembr of amalek from under heaven.

17:15 and mose built an altar, and call the name of it
jehovahnissi: 17:16 for he said, becaus the lord hath sworn that the
lord will have war with amalek from gener to generation.

18:1 when jethro, the priest of midian, moses' father in law, heard of
al that god had done for moses, and for israel hi people, and that
th lord had brought israel out of egypt; 18:2 then jethro, moses'
fath in law, took zipporah, moses' wife, after he had sent her back,
18:3 and her two sons; of which the name of the one wa gershom; for
h said, I have been an alien in a strang land: 18:4 and the name of
th other wa eliezer; for the god of my father, said he, wa mine
help, and deliv me from the sword of pharaoh: 18:5 and jethro,
moses' father in law, came with hi son and hi wife unto mose into
th wilderness, where he encamp at the mount of god: 18:6 and he
said unto moses, I thi father in law jethro am come unto thee, and thy
wife, and her two son with her.

18:7 and mose went out to meet hi father in law, and did obeisance,
and kiss him; and they ask each other of their welfare; and they
cam into the tent.

18:8 and mose told hi father in law all that the lord had done unto
pharaoh and to the egyptian for israel' sake, and all the travail
that had come upon them by the way, and how the lord deliv them.

18:9 and jethro rejoic for all the good which the lord had done
to israel, whom he had deliv out of the hand of the egyptians.

18:10 and jethro said, bless be the lord, who hath deliv you out
of the hand of the egyptians, and out of the hand of pharaoh, who hath
deliv the peopl from under the hand of the egyptians.

18:11 now I know that the lord is greater than all gods: for in the
th wherein they dealt proudli he wa abov them.

18:12 and jethro, moses' father in law, took a burnt offer and
sacrific for god: and aaron came, and all the elder of israel, to
eat bread with moses' father in law befor god.

18:13 and it came to pass on the morrow, that mose sat to judg the
people: and the peopl stood by mose from the morn unto the
evening.

18:14 and when moses' father in law saw all that he did to the people,
h said, what is thi thing that thou doest to the people? whi sittest
th thyself alone, and all the peopl stand by thee from morn unto
even?  18:15 and mose said unto hi father in law, becaus the people
com unto me to enquir of god: 18:16 when they have a matter, they
com unto me; and I judg between one and another, and I do make them
know the statut of god, and hi laws.

18:17 and moses' father in law said unto him, the thing that thou
doest is not good.

18:18 thou wilt sure wear away, both thou, and thi peopl that is
with thee: for thi thing is too heavi for thee; thou art not abl to
perform it thyself alone.

18:19 hearken now unto my voice, I will give thee counsel, and god
shal be with thee: Be thou for the peopl to god-ward, that thou
mayest bring the caus unto god: 18:20 and thou shalt teach them
ordin and laws, and shalt shew them the way wherein they must
walk, and the work that they must do.

18:21 moreov thou shalt provid out of all the peopl abl men, such
a fear god, men of truth, hate covetousness; and place such over
them, to be ruler of thousands, and ruler of hundreds, ruler of
fifties, and ruler of tens: 18:22 and let them judg the peopl at
al seasons: and it shall be, that everi great matter they shall bring
unto thee, but everi small matter they shall judge: so shall it be
easi for thyself, and they shall bear the burden with thee.

18:23 If thou shalt do thi thing, and god command thee so, then thou
shalt be abl to endure, and all thi peopl shall also go to their
plac in peace.

18:24 So mose hearken to the voic of hi father in law, and did
al that he had said.

18:25 and mose chose abl men out of all israel, and made them heads
ov the people, ruler of thousands, ruler of hundreds, ruler of
fifties, and ruler of tens.

18:26 and they judg the peopl at all seasons: the hard caus they
brought unto moses, but everi small matter they judg themselves.

18:27 and mose let hi father in law depart; and he went hi way into
hi own land.

19:1 In the third month, when the children of israel were gone forth
out of the land of egypt, the same day came they into the wilderness
of sinai.

19:2 for they were depart from rephidim, and were come to the desert
of sinai, and had pitch in the wilderness; and there israel camped
befor the mount.

19:3 and mose went up unto god, and the lord call unto him out of
th mountain, saying, thu shalt thou say to the hous of jacob, and
tel the children of israel; 19:4 Ye have seen what I did unto the
egyptians, and how I bare you on eagles' wings, and brought you unto
myself.

19:5 now therefore, if ye will obey my voic indeed, and keep my
covenant, then ye shall be a peculiar treasur unto me abov all
people: for all the earth is mine: 19:6 and ye shall be unto me a
kingdom of priests, and an holi nation.

thes are the word which thou shalt speak unto the children of
israel.

19:7 and mose came and call for the elder of the people, and laid
befor their face all these word which the lord command him.

19:8 and all the peopl answer together, and said, all that the lord
hath spoken we will do. and mose return the word of the people
unto the lord.

19:9 and the lord said unto moses, lo, I come unto thee in a thick
cloud, that the peopl may hear when I speak with thee, and believe
the for ever.

and mose told the word of the peopl unto the lord.

19:10 and the lord said unto moses, Go unto the people, and sanctify
them to day and to morrow, and let them wash their clothes, 19:11 and
b readi against the third day: for the third day the lord will come
down in the sight of all the peopl upon mount sinai.

19:12 and thou shalt set bound unto the peopl round about, saying,
tak heed to yourselves, that ye go not up into the mount, or touch
th border of it: whosoev toucheth the mount shall be sure put to
death: 19:13 there shall not an hand touch it, but he shall sure be
stoned, or shot through; whether it be beast or man, it shall not
live: when the trumpet soundeth long, they shall come up to the mount.

19:14 and mose went down from the mount unto the people, and
sanctifi the people; and they wash their clothes.

19:15 and he said unto the people, Be readi against the third day:
com not at your wives.

19:16 and it came to pass on the third day in the morning, that there
wer thunder and lightnings, and a thick cloud upon the mount, and
th voic of the trumpet exceed loud; so that all the peopl that
wa in the camp trembled.

19:17 and mose brought forth the peopl out of the camp to meet with
god; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.

19:18 and mount sinai wa altogeth on a smoke, becaus the lord
descend upon it in fire: and the smoke thereof ascend as the smoke
of a furnace, and the whole mount quak greatly.

19:19 and when the voic of the trumpet sound long, and wax louder
and louder, mose spake, and god answer him by a voice.

19:20 and the lord came down upon mount sinai, on the top of the
mount: and the lord call mose up to the top of the mount; and moses
w up.

19:21 and the lord said unto moses, Go down, charg the people, lest
they break through unto the lord to gaze, and mani of them perish.

19:22 and let the priest also, which come near to the lord, sanctify
themselves, lest the lord break forth upon them.

19:23 and mose said unto the lord, the peopl cannot come up to mount
sinai: for thou chargedst us, saying, set bound about the mount, and
sanctifi it.

19:24 and the lord said unto him, away, get thee down, and thou shalt
com up, thou, and aaron with thee: but let not the priest and the
peopl break through to come up unto the lord, lest he break forth
upon them.

19:25 So mose went down unto the people, and spake unto them.

20:1 and god spake all these words, saying, 20:2 I am the lord thy
god, which have brought thee out of the land of egypt, out of the
hous of bondage.

20:3 thou shalt have no other god befor me.

20:4 thou shalt not make unto thee ani graven image, or ani likeness
of ani thing that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath,
or that is in the water under the earth.

20:5 thou shalt not bow down thyself to them, nor serv them: for i
th lord thi god am a jealou god, visit the iniqu of the
fath upon the children unto the third and fourth gener of them
that hate me; 20:6 and shew merci unto thousand of them that love
me, and keep my commandments.

20:7 thou shalt not take the name of the lord thi god in vain; for the
lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh hi name in vain.

20:8 rememb the sabbath day, to keep it holy.

20:9 six day shalt thou labour, and do all thi work: 20:10 but the
seventh day is the sabbath of the lord thi god: in it thou shalt not
do ani work, thou, nor thi son, nor thi daughter, thi manservant, nor
thi maidservant, nor thi cattle, nor thi stranger that is within thy
gates: 20:11 for in six day the lord made heaven and earth, the sea,
and all that in them is, and rest the seventh day: wherefor the
lord bless the sabbath day, and hallow it.

20:12 honour thi father and thi mother: that thi day may be long upon
th land which the lord thi god giveth thee.

20:13 thou shalt not kill.

20:14 thou shalt not commit adultery.

20:15 thou shalt not steal.

20:16 thou shalt not bear fals wit against thi neighbour.

20:17 thou shalt not covet thi neighbour' house, thou shalt not covet
thi neighbour' wife, nor hi manservant, nor hi maidservant, nor his
ox, nor hi ass, nor ani thing that is thi neighbour's.

20:18 and all the peopl saw the thunderings, and the lightnings, and
th nois of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking: and when the
peopl saw it, they removed, and stood afar off.

20:19 and they said unto moses, speak thou with us, and we will hear:
but let not god speak with us, lest we die.

20:20 and mose said unto the people, fear not: for god is come to
prov you, and that hi fear may be befor your faces, that ye sin
not.

20:21 and the peopl stood afar off, and mose drew near unto the
thick dark where god was.

20:22 and the lord said unto moses, thu thou shalt say unto the
children of israel, Ye have seen that I have talk with you from
heaven.

20:23 Ye shall not make with me god of silver, neither shall ye make
unto you god of gold.

20:24 An altar of earth thou shalt make unto me, and shalt sacrifice
thereon thi burnt offerings, and thi peac offerings, thi sheep, and
thin oxen: in all place where I record my name I will come unto
thee, and I will bless thee.

20:25 and if thou wilt make me an altar of stone, thou shalt not build
it of hewn stone: for if thou lift up thi tool upon it, thou hast
pollut it.

20:26 neither shalt thou go up by step unto mine altar, that thy
naked be not discov thereon.

21:1 now these are the judgment which thou shalt set befor them.

21:2 If thou buy an hebrew servant, six year he shall serve: and in
th seventh he shall go out free for nothing.

21:3 If he came in by himself, he shall go out by himself: if he were
married, then hi wife shall go out with him.

21:4 If hi master have given him a wife, and she have born him sons
or daughters; the wife and her children shall be her master's, and he
shal go out by himself.

21:5 and if the servant shall plainli say, I love my master, my wife,
and my children; I will not go out free: 21:6 then hi master shall
br him unto the judges; he shall also bring him to the door, or
unto the door post; and hi master shall bore hi ear through with an
aul; and he shall serv him for ever.

21:7 and if a man sell hi daughter to be a maidservant, she shall not
go out as the menserv do.

21:8 If she pleas not her master, who hath betroth her to himself,
then shall he let her be redeemed: to sell her unto a strang nation
h shall have no power, see he hath dealt deceit with her.

21:9 and if he have betroth her unto hi son, he shall deal with her
aft the manner of daughters.

21:10 If he take him anoth wife; her food, her raiment, and her duty
of marriage, shall he not diminish.

21:11 and if he do not these three unto her, then shall she go out
fre without money.

21:12 He that smiteth a man, so that he die, shall be sure put to
death.

21:13 and if a man lie not in wait, but god deliv him into hi hand;
then I will appoint thee a place whither he shall flee.

21:14 but if a man come presumptu upon hi neighbour, to slay him
with guile; thou shalt take him from mine altar, that he may die.

21:15 and he that smiteth hi father, or hi mother, shall be surely
put to death.

21:16 and he that stealeth a man, and selleth him, or if he be found
in hi hand, he shall sure be put to death.

21:17 and he that curseth hi father, or hi mother, shall sure be
put to death.

21:18 and if men strive together, and one smite anoth with a stone,
or with hi fist, and he die not, but keepeth hi bed: 21:19 If he
ris again, and walk abroad upon hi staff, then shall he that smote
him be quit: onli he shall pay for the loss of hi time, and shall
caus him to be thoroughli healed.

21:20 and if a man smite hi servant, or hi maid, with a rod, and he
di under hi hand; he shall be sure punished.

21:21 notwithstanding, if he continu a day or two, he shall not be
punished: for he is hi money.

21:22 If men strive, and hurt a woman with child, so that her fruit
depart from her, and yet no mischief follow: he shall be surely
punished, accord as the woman' husband will lay upon him; and he
shal pay as the judg determine.

21:23 and if ani mischief follow, then thou shalt give life for life,
21:24 eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
21:25 burn for burning, wound for wound, stripe for stripe.

21:26 and if a man smite the eye of hi servant, or the eye of his
maid, that it perish; he shall let him go free for hi eye' sake.

21:27 and if he smite out hi manservant' tooth, or hi maidservant's
tooth; he shall let him go free for hi tooth' sake.

21:28 If an ox gore a man or a woman, that they die: then the ox shall
b sure stoned, and hi flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of
th ox shall be quit.

21:29 but if the ox were wont to push with hi horn in time past, and
it hath been testifi to hi owner, and he hath not kept him in, but
that he hath kill a man or a woman; the ox shall be stoned, and his
own also shall be put to death.

21:30 If there be laid on him a sum of money, then he shall give for
th ransom of hi life whatsoev is laid upon him.

21:31 whether he have gore a son, or have gore a daughter, according
to thi judgment shall it be done unto him.

21:32 If the ox shall push a manserv or a maidservant; he shall
giv unto their master thirti shekel of silver, and the ox shall be
stoned.

21:33 and if a man shall open a pit, or if a man shall dig a pit, and
not cover it, and an ox or an ass fall therein; 21:34 the owner of the
pit shall make it good, and give money unto the owner of them; and the
dead beast shall be his.

21:35 and if one man' ox hurt another's, that he die; then they shall
sel the live ox, and divid the money of it; and the dead ox also
they shall divide.

21:36 Or if it be known that the ox hath use to push in time past,
and hi owner hath not kept him in; he shall sure pay ox for ox; and
th dead shall be hi own.

22:1 If a man shall steal an ox, or a sheep, and kill it, or sell it;
h shall restor five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.

22:2 If a thief be found break up, and be smitten that he die,
ther shall no blood be shed for him.

22:3 If the sun be risen upon him, there shall be blood shed for him;
for he should make full restitution; if he have nothing, then he shall
b sold for hi theft.

22:4 If the theft be certainli found in hi hand alive, whether it be
ox, or ass, or sheep; he shall restor double.

22:5 If a man shall caus a field or vineyard to be eaten, and shall
put in hi beast, and shall feed in anoth man' field; of the best
of hi own field, and of the best of hi own vineyard, shall he make
restitution.

22:6 If fire break out, and catch in thorns, so that the stack of
corn, or the stand corn, or the field, be consum therewith; he
that kindl the fire shall sure make restitution.

22:7 If a man shall deliv unto hi neighbour money or stuff to keep,
and it be stolen out of the man' house; if the thief be found, let
him pay double.

22:8 If the thief be not found, then the master of the hous shall be
brought unto the judges, to see whether he have put hi hand unto his
neighbour' goods.

22:9 for all manner of trespass, whether it be for ox, for ass, for
sheep, for raiment, or for ani manner of lost thing which another
challengeth to be his, the caus of both parti shall come befor the
judges; and whom the judg shall condemn, he shall pay doubl unto
hi neighbour.

22:10 If a man deliv unto hi neighbour an ass, or an ox, or a
sheep, or ani beast, to keep; and it die, or be hurt, or driven away,
no man see it: 22:11 then shall an oath of the lord be between them
both, that he hath not put hi hand unto hi neighbour' goods; and
th owner of it shall accept thereof, and he shall not make it good.

22:12 and if it be stolen from him, he shall make restitut unto the
own thereof.

22:13 If it be torn in pieces, then let him bring it for witness, and
h shall not make good that which wa torn.

22:14 and if a man borrow ought of hi neighbour, and it be hurt, or
die, the owner thereof be not with it, he shall sure make it
good.

22:15 but if the owner thereof be with it, he shall not make it good:
if it be an hire thing, it came for hi hire.

22:16 and if a man entic a maid that is not betrothed, and lie with
her, he shall sure endow her to be hi wife.

22:17 If her father utterli refus to give her unto him, he shall pay
money accord to the dowri of virgins.

22:18 thou shalt not suffer a witch to live.

22:19 whosoev lieth with a beast shall sure be put to death.

22:20 He that sacrificeth unto ani god, save unto the lord only, he
shal be utterli destroyed.

22:21 thou shalt neither vex a stranger, nor oppress him: for ye were
strang in the land of egypt.

22:22 Ye shall not afflict ani widow, or fatherless child.

22:23 If thou afflict them in ani wise, and they cri at all unto me, i
wil sure hear their cry; 22:24 and my wrath shall wax hot, and i
wil kill you with the sword; and your wive shall be widows, and your
children fatherless.

22:25 If thou lend money to ani of my peopl that is poor by thee,
thou shalt not be to him as an usurer, neither shalt thou lay upon him
usury.

22:26 If thou at all take thi neighbour' raiment to pledge, thou
shalt deliv it unto him by that the sun goeth down: 22:27 for that
i hi cover only, it is hi raiment for hi skin: wherein shall he
sleep? and it shall come to pass, when he crieth unto me, that I will
hear; for I am gracious.

22:28 thou shalt not revil the gods, nor curs the ruler of thy
people.

22:29 thou shalt not delay to offer the first of thi ripe fruits, and
of thi liquors: the firstborn of thi son shalt thou give unto me.

22:30 likewis shalt thou do with thine oxen, and with thi sheep:
seven day it shall be with hi dam; on the eighth day thou shalt give
it me.

22:31 and ye shall be holi men unto me: neither shall ye eat ani flesh
that is torn of beast in the field; ye shall cast it to the dogs.

23:1 thou shalt not rais a fals report: put not thine hand with the
wick to be an unright witness.

23:2 thou shalt not follow a multitud to do evil; neither shalt thou
speak in a caus to declin after mani to wrest judgment: 23:3 neither
shalt thou counten a poor man in hi cause.

23:4 If thou meet thine enemy' ox or hi ass go astray, thou shalt
sur bring it back to him again.

23:5 If thou see the ass of him that hateth thee lie under his
burden, and wouldest forbear to help him, thou shalt sure help with
him.

23:6 thou shalt not wrest the judgment of thi poor in hi cause.

23:7 keep thee far from a fals matter; and the innoc and righteous
slay thou not: for I will not justifi the wicked.

23:8 and thou shalt take no gift: for the gift blindeth the wise, and
perverteth the word of the righteous.

23:9 also thou shalt not oppress a stranger: for ye know the heart of
a stranger, see ye were stranger in the land of egypt.

23:10 and six year thou shalt sow thi land, and shalt gather in the
fruit thereof: 23:11 but the seventh year thou shalt let it rest and
li still; that the poor of thi peopl may eat: and what they leave
th beast of the field shall eat. In like manner thou shalt deal with
thi vineyard, and with thi oliveyard.

23:12 six day thou shalt do thi work, and on the seventh day thou
shalt rest: that thine ox and thine ass may rest, and the son of thy
handmaid, and the stranger, may be refreshed.

23:13 and in all thing that I have said unto you be circumspect: and
mak no mention of the name of other gods, neither let it be heard out
of thi mouth.

23:14 three time thou shalt keep a feast unto me in the year.

23:15 thou shalt keep the feast of unleaven bread: (thou shalt eat
unleaven bread seven days, as I command thee, in the time
appoint of the month abib; for in it thou camest out from egypt: and
non shall appear befor me empty:) 23:16 and the feast of harvest,
th firstfruit of thi labours, which thou hast sown in the field: and
th feast of ingathering, which is in the end of the year, when thou
hast gather in thi labour out of the field.

23:17 three item in the year all thi male shall appear befor the
lord god.

23:18 thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrific with leavened
bread; neither shall the fat of my sacrific remain until the morning.

23:19 the first of the firstfruit of thi land thou shalt bring into
th hous of the lord thi god. thou shalt not seeth a kid in his
mother' milk.

23:20 behold, I send an angel befor thee, to keep thee in the way,
and to bring thee into the place which I have prepared.

23:21 bewar of him, and obey hi voice, provok him not; for he will
not pardon your transgressions: for my name is in him.

23:22 but if thou shalt inde obey hi voice, and do all that i
speak; then I will be an enemi unto thine enemies, and an adversary
unto thine adversaries.

23:23 for mine angel shall go befor thee, and bring thee in unto the
amorites, and the hittites, and the perizzites, and the canaanites,
th hivites, and the jebusites: and I will cut them off.

23:24 thou shalt not bow down to their gods, nor serv them, nor do
aft their works: but thou shalt utterli overthrow them, and quite
break down their images.

23:25 and ye shall serv the lord your god, and he shall bless thy
bread, and thi water; and I will take sick away from the midst of
thee.

23:26 there shall noth cast their young, nor be barren, in thy
land: the number of thi day I will fulfil.

23:27 I will send my fear befor thee, and will destroy all the people
to whom thou shalt come, and I will make all thine enemi turn their
back unto thee.

23:28 and I will send hornet befor thee, which shall drive out the
hivite, the canaanite, and the hittite, from befor thee.

23:29 I will not drive them out from befor thee in one year; lest the
land becom desolate, and the beast of the field multipli against
thee.

23:30 By littl and littl I will drive them out from befor thee,
until thou be increased, and inherit the land.

23:31 and I will set thi bound from the red sea even unto the sea of
th philistines, and from the desert unto the river: for I will
deliv the inhabit of the land into your hand; and thou shalt
driv them out befor thee.

23:32 thou shalt make no coven with them, nor with their gods.

23:33 they shall not dwell in thi land, lest they make thee sin
against me: for if thou serv their gods, it will sure be a snare
unto thee.

24:1 and he said unto moses, come up unto the lord, thou, and aaron,
nadab, and abihu, and seventi of the elder of israel; and worship ye
afar off.

24:2 and mose alon shall come near the lord: but they shall not come
nigh; neither shall the peopl go up with him.

24:3 and mose came and told the peopl all the word of the lord, and
al the judgments: and all the peopl answer with one voice, and
said, all the word which the lord hath said will we do.

24:4 and mose wrote all the word of the lord, and rose up earli in
th morning, and build an altar under the hill, and twelv pillars,
accord to the twelv tribe of israel.

24:5 and he sent young men of the children of israel, which offered
burnt offerings, and sacrif peac offer of oxen unto the lord.

24:6 and mose took half of the blood, and put it in basons; and half
of the blood he sprinkl on the altar.

24:7 and he took the book of the covenant, and read in the audienc of
th people: and they said, all that the lord hath said will we do, and
b obedient.

24:8 and mose took the blood, and sprinkl it on the people, and
said, behold the blood of the covenant, which the lord hath made with
you concern all these words.

24:9 then went up moses, and aaron, nadab, and abihu, and seventi of
th elder of israel: 24:10 and they saw the god of israel: and there
wa under hi feet as it were a pave work of a sapphir stone, and as
it were the bodi of heaven in hi clearness.

24:11 and upon the nobl of the children of israel he laid not his
hand: also they saw god, and did eat and drink.

24:12 and the lord said unto moses, come up to me into the mount, and
b there: and I will give thee tabl of stone, and a law, and
command which I have written; that thou mayest teach them.

24:13 and mose rose up, and hi minist joshua: and mose went up
into the mount of god.

24:14 and he said unto the elders, tarri ye here for us, until we come
again unto you: and, behold, aaron and hur are with you: if ani man
hav ani matter to do, let him come unto them.

24:15 and mose went up into the mount, and a cloud cover the mount.

24:16 and the glori of the lord abod upon mount sinai, and the cloud
cov it six days: and the seventh day he call unto mose out of
th midst of the cloud.

24:17 and the sight of the glori of the lord wa like devour fire
on the top of the mount in the eye of the children of israel.

24:18 and mose went into the midst of the cloud, and gat him up into
th mount: and mose wa in the mount forti day and forti nights.

25:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 25:2 speak unto the
children of israel, that they bring me an offering: of everi man that
giveth it willingli with hi heart ye shall take my offering.

25:3 and thi is the offer which ye shall take of them; gold, and
silver, and brass, 25:4 and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine
linen, and goats' hair, 25:5 and rams' skin dy red, and badgers'
skins, and shittim wood, 25:6 oil for the light, spice for anointing
oil, and for sweet incense, 25:7 onyx stones, and stone to be set in
th ephod, and in the breastplate.

25:8 and let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them.

25:9 accord to all that I shew thee, after the pattern of the
tabernacle, and the pattern of all the instrument thereof, even so
shal ye make it.

25:10 and they shall make an ark of shittim wood: two cubit and a
half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth
thereof, and a cubit and a half the height thereof.

25:11 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, within and without
shalt thou overlay it, and shalt make upon it a crown of gold round
about.

25:12 and thou shalt cast four ring of gold for it, and put them in
th four corner thereof; and two ring shall be in the one side of
it, and two ring in the other side of it.

25:13 and thou shalt make stave of shittim wood, and overlay them
with gold.

25:14 and thou shalt put the stave into the ring by the side of the
ark, that the ark may be born with them.

25:15 the stave shall be in the ring of the ark: they shall not be
taken from it.

25:16 and thou shalt put into the ark the testimoni which I shall give
thee.

25:17 and thou shalt make a merci seat of pure gold: two cubit and a
half shall be the length thereof, and a cubit and a half the breadth
thereof.

25:18 and thou shalt make two cherubim of gold, of beaten work shalt
thou make them, in the two end of the merci seat.

25:19 and make one cherub on the one end, and the other cherub on the
oth end: even of the merci seat shall ye make the cherubim on the
two end thereof.

25:20 and the cherubim shall stretch forth their wing on high,
cov the merci seat with their wings, and their face shall look
on to another; toward the merci seat shall the face of the cherubims
be.

25:21 and thou shalt put the merci seat abov upon the ark; and in the
ark thou shalt put the testimoni that I shall give thee.

25:22 and there I will meet with thee, and I will commun with thee
from abov the merci seat, from between the two cherubim which are
upon the ark of the testimony, of all thing which I will give thee in
command unto the children of israel.

25:23 thou shalt also make a tabl of shittim wood: two cubit shall
b the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit
and a half the height thereof.

25:24 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, and make thereto a
crown of gold round about.

25:25 and thou shalt make unto it a border of an hand breadth round
about, and thou shalt make a golden crown to the border thereof round
about.

25:26 and thou shalt make for it four ring of gold, and put the rings
in the four corner that are on the four feet thereof.

25:27 over against the border shall the ring be for place of the
stav to bear the table.

25:28 and thou shalt make the stave of shittim wood, and overlay them
with gold, that the tabl may be born with them.

25:29 and thou shalt make the dish thereof, and spoon thereof, and
cov thereof, and bowl thereof, to cover withal: of pure gold shalt
thou make them.

25:30 and thou shalt set upon the tabl shewbread befor me alway.

25:31 and thou shalt make a candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work
shal the candlestick be made: hi shaft, and hi branches, hi bowls,
hi knops, and hi flowers, shall be of the same.

25:32 and six branch shall come out of the side of it; three
branch of the candlestick out of the one side, and three branch of
th candlestick out of the other side: 25:33 three bowl made like
unto almonds, with a knop and a flower in one branch; and three bowls
mad like almond in the other branch, with a knop and a flower: so in
th six branch that come out of the candlestick.

25:34 and in the candlestick shall be four bowl made like unto
almonds, with their knop and their flowers.

25:35 and there shall be a knop under two branch of the same, and a
knop under two branch of the same, and a knop under two branch of
th same, accord to the six branch that proceed out of the
candlestick.

25:36 their knop and their branch shall be of the same: all it
shal be one beaten work of pure gold.

25:37 and thou shalt make the seven lamp thereof: and they shall
light the lamp thereof, that they may give light over against it.

25:38 and the tong thereof, and the snuffdish thereof, shall be of
pur gold.

25:39 Of a talent of pure gold shall he make it, with all these
vessels.

25:40 and look that thou make them after their pattern, which was
shew thee in the mount.

26:1 moreov thou shalt make the tabernacl with ten curtain of fine
twin linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet: with cherubim of
cun work shalt thou make them.

26:2 the length of one curtain shall be eight and twenti cubits, and
th breadth of one curtain four cubits: and everi one of the curtains
shal have one measure.

26:3 the five curtain shall be coupl togeth one to another; and
oth five curtain shall be coupl one to another.

26:4 and thou shalt make loop of blue upon the edg of the one
curtain from the selvedg in the coupling; and likewis shalt thou
mak in the uttermost edg of anoth curtain, in the coupl of the
second.

26:5 fifti loop shalt thou make in the one curtain, and fifti loops
shalt thou make in the edg of the curtain that is in the coupl of
th second; that the loop may take hold one of another.

26:6 and thou shalt make fifti tach of gold, and coupl the curtains
togeth with the taches: and it shall be one tabernacle.

26:7 and thou shalt make curtain of goats' hair to be a cover upon
th tabernacle: eleven curtain shalt thou make.

26:8 the length of one curtain shall be thirti cubits, and the breadth
of one curtain four cubits: and the eleven curtain shall be all of
on measure.

26:9 and thou shalt coupl five curtain by themselves, and six
curtain by themselves, and shalt doubl the sixth curtain in the
forefront of the tabernacle.

26:10 and thou shalt make fifti loop on the edg of the one curtain
that is outmost in the coupling, and fifti loop in the edg of the
curtain which coupleth the second.

26:11 and thou shalt make fifti tach of brass, and put the taches
into the loops, and coupl the tent together, that it may be one.

26:12 and the remnant that remaineth of the curtain of the tent, the
half curtain that remaineth, shall hang over the backsid of the
tabernacle.

26:13 and a cubit on the one side, and a cubit on the other side of
that which remaineth in the length of the curtain of the tent, it
shal hang over the side of the tabernacl on thi side and on that
side, to cover it.

26:14 and thou shalt make a cover for the tent of rams' skin dyed
red, and a cover abov of badgers' skins.

26:15 and thou shalt make board for the tabernacl of shittim wood
stand up.

26:16 ten cubit shall be the length of a board, and a cubit and a
half shall be the breadth of one board.

26:17 two tenon shall there be in one board, set in order one against
another: thu shalt thou make for all the board of the tabernacle.

26:18 and thou shalt make the board for the tabernacle, twenti boards
on the south side southward.

26:19 and thou shalt make forti socket of silver under the twenty
boards; two socket under one board for hi two tenons, and two
socket under anoth board for hi two tenons.

26:20 and for the second side of the tabernacl on the north side
ther shall be twenti boards: 26:21 and their forti socket of silver;
two socket under one board, and two socket under anoth board.

26:22 and for the side of the tabernacl westward thou shalt make six
boards.

26:23 and two board shalt thou make for the corner of the tabernacle
in the two sides.

26:24 and they shall be coupl togeth beneath, and they shall be
coupl togeth abov the head of it unto one ring: thu shall it be
for them both; they shall be for the two corners.

26:25 and they shall be eight boards, and their socket of silver,
sixteen sockets; two socket under one board, and two socket under
anoth board.

26:26 and thou shalt make bar of shittim wood; five for the board of
th one side of the tabernacle, 26:27 and five bar for the board of
th other side of the tabernacle, and five bar for the board of the
sid of the tabernacle, for the two side westward.

26:28 and the middl bar in the midst of the board shall reach from
end to end.

26:29 and thou shalt overlay the board with gold, and make their
r of gold for place for the bars: and thou shalt overlay the bars
with gold.

26:30 and thou shalt rear up the tabernacl accord to the fashion
thereof which wa shew thee in the mount.

26:31 and thou shalt make a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and
fin twine linen of cun work: with cherubim shall it be made:
26:32 and thou shalt hang it upon four pillar of shittim wood
overlaid with gold: their hook shall be of gold, upon the four
socket of silver.

26:33 and thou shalt hang up the vail under the taches, that thou
mayest bring in thither within the vail the ark of the testimony: and
th vail shall divid unto you between the holi place and the most
holy.

26:34 and thou shalt put the merci seat upon the ark of the testimony
in the most holi place.

26:35 and thou shalt set the tabl without the vail, and the
candlestick over against the tabl on the side of the tabernacle
toward the south: and thou shalt put the tabl on the north side.

26:36 and thou shalt make an hang for the door of the tent, of
blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen, wrought with
needlework.

26:37 and thou shalt make for the hang five pillar of shittim
wood, and overlay them with gold, and their hook shall be of gold:
and thou shalt cast five socket of brass for them.

27:1 and thou shalt make an altar of shittim wood, five cubit long,
and five cubit broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and the height
thereof shall be three cubits.

27:2 and thou shalt make the horn of it upon the four corners
thereof: hi horn shall be of the same: and thou shalt overlay it
with brass.

27:3 and thou shalt make hi pan to receiv hi ashes, and his
shovels, and hi basons, and hi fleshhooks, and hi firepans: all the
vessel thereof thou shalt make of brass.

27:4 and thou shalt make for it a grate of network of brass; and upon
th net shalt thou make four brasen ring in the four corner thereof.

27:5 and thou shalt put it under the compass of the altar beneath,
that the net may be even to the midst of the altar.

27:6 and thou shalt make stave for the altar, stave of shittim wood,
and overlay them with brass.

27:7 and the stave shall be put into the rings, and the stave shall
b upon the two side of the altar, to bear it.

27:8 hollow with board shalt thou make it: as it wa shew thee in
th mount, so shall they make it.

27:9 and thou shalt make the court of the tabernacle: for the south
sid southward there shall be hang for the court of fine twined
linen of an hundr cubit long for one side: 27:10 and the twenty
pillar thereof and their twenti socket shall be of brass; the hooks
of the pillar and their fillet shall be of silver.

27:11 and likewis for the north side in length there shall be
hang of an hundr cubit long, and hi twenti pillar and their
twenti socket of brass; the hook of the pillar and their fillet of
silver.

27:12 and for the breadth of the court on the west side shall be
hang of fifti cubits: their pillar ten, and their socket ten.

27:13 and the breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be
fifti cubits.

27:14 the hang of one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits:
their pillar three, and their socket three.

27:15 and on the other side shall be hang fifteen cubits: their
pillar three, and their socket three.

27:16 and for the gate of the court shall be an hang of twenty
cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen,
wrought with needlework: and their pillar shall be four, and their
socket four.

27:17 all the pillar round about the court shall be fillet with
silver; their hook shall be of silver, and their socket of brass.

27:18 the length of the court shall be an hundr cubits, and the
breadth fifti everi where, and the height five cubit of fine twined
linen, and their socket of brass.

27:19 all the vessel of the tabernacl in all the servic thereof,
and all the pin thereof, and all the pin of the court, shall be of
brass.

27:20 and thou shalt command the children of israel, that they bring
the pure oil oliv beaten for the light, to caus the lamp to burn
always.

27:21 In the tabernacl of the congreg without the vail, which is
befor the testimony, aaron and hi son shall order it from evening
to morn befor the lord: it shall be a statut for ever unto their
gener on the behalf of the children of israel.

28:1 and take thou unto thee aaron thi brother, and hi son with him,
from among the children of israel, that he may minist unto me in the
priest' office, even aaron, nadab and abihu, eleazar and ithamar,
aaron' sons.

28:2 and thou shalt make holi garment for aaron thi brother for glory
and for beauty.

28:3 and thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have
fil with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make aaron' garments
to consecr him, that he may minist unto me in the priest's
office.

28:4 and these are the garment which they shall make; a breastplate,
and an ephod, and a robe, and a broider coat, a mitre, and a girdle:
and they shall make holi garment for aaron thi brother, and hi sons,
that he may minist unto me in the priest' office.

28:5 and they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and
fin linen.

28:6 and they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of
scarlet, and fine twine linen, with cun work.

28:7 It shall have the two shoulderpiec thereof join at the two
edg thereof; and so it shall be join together.

28:8 and the curiou girdl of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be
of the same, accord to the work thereof; even of gold, of blue, and
purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen.

28:9 and thou shalt take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names
of the children of israel: 28:10 six of their name on one stone, and
th other six name of the rest on the other stone, accord to their
birth.

28:11 with the work of an engrav in stone, like the engrav of a
signet, shalt thou engrav the two stone with the name of the
children of israel: thou shalt make them to be set in ouch of gold.

28:12 and thou shalt put the two stone upon the shoulder of the
ephod for stone of memori unto the children of israel: and aaron
shal bear their name befor the lord upon hi two shoulder for a
memorial.

28:13 and thou shalt make ouch of gold; 28:14 and two chain of pure
gold at the ends; of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten
th wreathen chain to the ouches.

28:15 and thou shalt make the breastplat of judgment with cunning
work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of
blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twine linen, shalt
thou make it.

28:16 foursquar it shall be be doubled; a span shall be the length
thereof, and a span shall be the breadth thereof.

28:17 and thou shalt set in it set of stones, even four row of
stones: the first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle:
thi shall be the first row.

28:18 and the second row shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a
diamond.

28:19 and the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.

28:20 and the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they
shal be set in gold in their inclosings.

28:21 and the stone shall be with the name of the children of
israel, twelve, accord to their names, like the engrav of a
signet; everi one with hi name shall they be accord to the twelve
tribes.

28:22 and thou shalt make upon the breastplat chain at the end of
wreathen work of pure gold.

28:23 and thou shalt make upon the breastplat two ring of gold, and
shalt put the two ring on the two end of the breastplate.

28:24 and thou shalt put the two wreathen chain of gold in the two
r which are on the end of the breastplate.

28:25 and the other two end of the two wreathen chain thou shalt
fasten in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpiec of the
ephod befor it.

28:26 and thou shalt make two ring of gold, and thou shalt put them
upon the two end of the breastplat in the border thereof, which is
in the side of the ephod inward.

28:27 and two other ring of gold thou shalt make, and shalt put them
on the two side of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart thereof,
ov against the other coupl thereof, abov the curiou girdl of
th ephod.

28:28 and they shall bind the breastplat by the ring thereof unto
th ring of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be abov the
curi girdl of the ephod, and that the breastplat be not loosed
from the ephod.

28:29 and aaron shall bear the name of the children of israel in the
breastpl of judgment upon hi heart, when he goeth in unto the holy
place, for a memori befor the lord continually.

28:30 and thou shalt put in the breastplat of judgment the urim and
th thummim; and they shall be upon aaron' heart, when he goeth in
befor the lord: and aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of
israel upon hi heart befor the lord continually.

28:31 and thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.

28:32 and there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst
thereof: it shall have a bind of woven work round about the hole of
it, as it were the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.

28:33 and beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegran of
blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and
bel of gold between them round about: 28:34 A golden bell and a
pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe
round about.

28:35 and it shall be upon aaron to minister: and hi sound shall be
heard when he goeth in unto the holi place befor the lord, and when
h cometh out, that he die not.

28:36 and thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it,
lik the engrav of a signet, holi TO the lord.

28:37 and thou shalt put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the
mitre; upon the forefront of the mitr it shall be.

28:38 and it shall be upon aaron' forehead, that aaron may bear the
iniqu of the holi things, which the children of israel shall hallow
in all their holi gifts; and it shall be alway upon hi forehead,
that they may be accept befor the lord.

28:39 and thou shalt embroid the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt
mak the mitr of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdl of
needlework.

28:40 and for aaron' son thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make
for them girdles, and bonnet shalt thou make for them, for glori and
for beauty.

28:41 and thou shalt put them upon aaron thi brother, and hi sons
with him; and shalt anoint them, and consecr them, and sanctify
them, that they may minist unto me in the priest' office.

28:42 and thou shalt make them linen breech to cover their
nakedness; from the loin even unto the thigh they shall reach: 28:43
and they shall be upon aaron, and upon hi sons, when they come in
unto the tabernacl of the congregation, or when they come near unto
th altar to minist in the holi place; that they bear not iniquity,
and die: it shall be a statut for ever unto him and hi seed after
him.

29:1 and thi is the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow
them, to minist unto me in the priest' office: take one young
bullock, and two ram without blemish, 29:2 and unleaven bread, and
cak unleaven temper with oil, and wafer unleaven anointed
with oil: of wheaten flour shalt thou make them.

29:3 and thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the
basket, with the bullock and the two rams.

29:4 and aaron and hi son thou shalt bring unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.

29:5 and thou shalt take the garments, and put upon aaron the coat,
and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and
gird him with the curiou girdl of the ephod: 29:6 and thou shalt put
th mitr upon hi head, and put the holi crown upon the mitre.

29:7 then shalt thou take the anoint oil, and pour it upon his
head, and anoint him.

29:8 and thou shalt bring hi sons, and put coat upon them.

29:9 and thou shalt gird them with girdles, aaron and hi sons, and
put the bonnet on them: and the priest' offic shall be their for a
perpetu statute: and thou shalt consecr aaron and hi sons.

29:10 and thou shalt caus a bullock to be brought befor the
tabernacl of the congregation: and aaron and hi son shall put their
hand upon the head of the bullock.

29:11 and thou shalt kill the bullock befor the lord, by the door of
th tabernacl of the congregation.

29:12 and thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put it upon
th horn of the altar with thi finger, and pour all the blood beside
th bottom of the altar.

29:13 and thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and
th caul that is abov the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat
that is upon them, and burn them upon the altar.

29:14 but the flesh of the bullock, and hi skin, and hi dung, shalt
thou burn with fire without the camp: it is a sin offering.

29:15 thou shalt also take one ram; and aaron and hi son shall put
their hand upon the head of the ram.

29:16 and thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take hi blood, and
sprinkl it round about upon the altar.

29:17 and thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inward of
him, and hi legs, and put them unto hi pieces, and unto hi head.

29:18 and thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it is a burnt
off unto the lord: it is a sweet savour, an offer made by fire
unto the lord.

29:19 and thou shalt take the other ram; and aaron and hi son shall
put their hand upon the head of the ram.

29:20 then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of hi blood, and put it
upon the tip of the right ear of aaron, and upon the tip of the right
ear of hi sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the
great toe of their right foot, and sprinkl the blood upon the altar
round about.

29:21 and thou shalt take of the blood that is upon the altar, and of
th anoint oil, and sprinkl it upon aaron, and upon hi garments,
and upon hi sons, and upon the garment of hi son with him: and he
shal be hallowed, and hi garments, and hi sons, and hi sons'
gar with him.

29:22 also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the
fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul abov the liver, and the
two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, and the right shoulder;
for it is a ram of consecration: 29:23 and one loaf of bread, and one
cak of oil bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened
bread that is befor the lord: 29:24 and thou shalt put all in the
hand of aaron, and in the hand of hi sons; and shalt wave them for
a wave offer befor the lord.

29:25 and thou shalt receiv them of their hands, and burn them upon
th altar for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour befor the lord: it
i an offer made by fire unto the lord.

29:26 and thou shalt take the breast of the ram of aaron's
consecration, and wave it for a wave offer befor the lord: and it
shal be thi part.

29:27 and thou shalt sanctifi the breast of the wave offering, and the
should of the heav offering, which is waved, and which is heaved
up, of the ram of the consecration, even of that which is for aaron,
and of that which is for hi sons: 29:28 and it shall be aaron' and
hi sons' by a statut for ever from the children of israel: for it is
an heav offering: and it shall be an heav offer from the children
of israel of the sacrific of their peac offerings, even their heave
off unto the lord.
