29:29 and the holi garment of aaron shall be hi sons' after him, to
b anoint therein, and to be consecr in them.

29:30 and that son that is priest in hi stead shall put them on seven
days, when he cometh into the tabernacl of the congreg to
minist in the holi place.

29:31 and thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seeth his
flesh in the holi place.

29:32 and aaron and hi son shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the
bread that is in the basket by the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation.

29:33 and they shall eat those thing wherewith the aton was
made, to consecr and to sanctifi them: but a stranger shall not eat
thereof, becaus they are holy.

29:34 and if ought of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread,
remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remaind with fire:
it shall not be eaten, becaus it is holy.

29:35 and thu shalt thou do unto aaron, and to hi sons, accord to
al thing which I have command thee: seven day shalt thou
consecr them.

29:36 and thou shalt offer everi day a bullock for a sin offer for
atonement: and thou shalt cleans the altar, when thou hast made an
aton for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctifi it.

29:37 seven day thou shalt make an aton for the altar, and
sanctifi it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoev toucheth
th altar shall be holy.

29:38 now thi is that which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two
lamb of the first year day by day continually.

29:39 the one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb
thou shalt offer at even: 29:40 and with the one lamb a tenth deal of
flour mingl with the fourth part of an hin of beaten oil; and the
fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offering.

29:41 and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, and shalt do
thereto accord to the meat offer of the morning, and according
to the drink offer thereof, for a sweet savour, an offer made by
fir unto the lord.

29:42 thi shall be a continu burnt offer throughout your
gener at the door of the tabernacl of the congreg before
th lord: where I will meet you, to speak there unto thee.

29:43 and there I will meet with the children of israel, and the
tabernacl shall be sanctifi by my glory.

29:44 and I will sanctifi the tabernacl of the congregation, and the
altar: I will sanctifi also both aaron and hi sons, to minist to me
in the priest' office.

29:45 and I will dwell among the children of israel, and will be their
god.

29:46 and they shall know that I am the lord their god, that brought
them forth out of the land of egypt, that I may dwell among them: I am
th lord their god.

30:1 and thou shalt make an altar to burn incens upon: of shittim
wood shalt thou make it.

30:2 A cubit shall be the length thereof, and a cubit the breadth
thereof; foursquar shall it be: and two cubit shall be the height
thereof: the horn thereof shall be of the same.

30:3 and thou shalt overlay it with pure gold, the top thereof, and
th side thereof round about, and the horn thereof; and thou shalt
mak unto it a crown of gold round about.

30:4 and two golden ring shalt thou make to it under the crown of it,
bi the two corner thereof, upon the two side of it shalt thou make
it; and they shall be for place for the stave to bear it withal.

30:5 and thou shalt make the stave of shittim wood, and overlay them
with gold.

30:6 and thou shalt put it befor the vail that is by the ark of the
testimony, befor the merci seat that is over the testimony, where i
wil meet with thee.

30:7 and aaron shall burn thereon sweet incens everi morning: when he
dresseth the lamps, he shall burn incens upon it.

30:8 and when aaron lighteth the lamp at even, he shall burn incense
upon it, a perpetu incens befor the lord throughout your
generations.

30:9 Ye shall offer no strang incens thereon, nor burnt sacrifice,
nor meat offering; neither shall ye pour drink offer thereon.

30:10 and aaron shall make an aton upon the horn of it onc in a
year with the blood of the sin offer of atonements: onc in the
year shall he make aton upon it throughout your generations: it
i most holi unto the lord.

30:11 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 30:12 when thou takest
th sum of the children of israel after their number, then shall they
giv everi man a ransom for hi soul unto the lord, when thou
numberest them; that there be no plagu among them, when thou
numberest them.

30:13 thi they shall give, everi one that passeth among them that are
numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary: (a shekel
i twenti gerahs:) an half shekel shall be the offer of the lord.

30:14 everi one that passeth among them that are numbered, from twenty
year old and above, shall give an offer unto the lord.

30:15 the rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less
than half a shekel, when they give an offer unto the lord, to make
an aton for your souls.

30:16 and thou shalt take the aton money of the children of
israel, and shalt appoint it for the servic of the tabernacl of the
congregation; that it may be a memori unto the children of israel
befor the lord, to make an aton for your souls.

30:17 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 30:18 thou shalt also
mak a laver of brass, and hi foot also of brass, to wash withal: and
thou shalt put it between the tabernacl of the congreg and the
altar, and thou shalt put water therein.

30:19 for aaron and hi son shall wash their hand and their feet
thereat: 30:20 when they go into the tabernacl of the congregation,
they shall wash with water, that they die not; or when they come near
to the altar to minister, to burn offer made by fire unto the lord:
30:21 So they shall wash their hand and their feet, that they die
not: and it shall be a statut for ever to them, even to him and to
hi seed throughout their generations.

30:22 moreov the lord spake unto moses, saying, 30:23 take thou also
unto thee princip spices, of pure myrrh five hundr shekels, and of
sweet cinnamon half so much, even two hundr and fifti shekels, and
of sweet calamu two hundr and fifti shekels, 30:24 and of cassia
f hundr shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, and of oil
ol an hin: 30:25 and thou shalt make it an oil of holi ointment, an
oint compound after the art of the apothecary: it shall be an holy
anoint oil.

30:26 and thou shalt anoint the tabernacl of the congregation
therewith, and the ark of the testimony, 30:27 and the tabl and all
hi vessels, and the candlestick and hi vessels, and the altar of
incense, 30:28 and the altar of burnt offer with all hi vessels,
and the laver and hi foot.

30:29 and thou shalt sanctifi them, that they may be most holy:
whatsoev toucheth them shall be holy.

30:30 and thou shalt anoint aaron and hi sons, and consecr them,
that they may minist unto me in the priest' office.

30:31 and thou shalt speak unto the children of israel, saying, this
shal be an holi anoint oil unto me throughout your generations.

30:32 upon man' flesh shall it not be poured, neither shall ye make
ani other like it, after the composit of it: it is holy, and it
shal be holi unto you.

30:33 whosoev compoundeth ani like it, or whosoev putteth ani of
it upon a stranger, shall even be cut off from hi people.

30:34 and the lord said unto moses, take unto thee sweet spices,
stacte, and onycha, and galbanum; these sweet spice with pure
frankincense: of each shall there be a like weight: 30:35 and thou
shalt make it a perfume, a confect after the art of the apothecary,
temp together, pure and holy: 30:36 and thou shalt beat some of it
veri small, and put of it befor the testimoni in the tabernacl of
th congregation, where I will meet with thee: it shall be unto you
most holy.

30:37 and as for the perfum which thou shalt make, ye shall not make
to yourselv accord to the composit thereof: it shall be unto
the holi for the lord.

30:38 whosoev shall make like unto that, to smell thereto, shall
even be cut off from hi people.

31:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 31:2 see, I have call by
nam bezaleel the son of uri, the son of hur, of the tribe of judah:
31:3 and I have fill him with the spirit of god, in wisdom, and in
understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,
31:4 To devis cun works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in
brass, 31:5 and in cut of stones, to set them, and in carv of
timber, to work in all manner of workmanship.

31:6 and I, behold, I have given with him aholiab, the son of
ahisamach, of the tribe of dan: and in the heart of all that are wise
heart I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have
command thee; 31:7 the tabernacl of the congregation, and the ark
of the testimony, and the merci seat that is thereupon, and all the
furnitur of the tabernacle, 31:8 and the tabl and hi furniture, and
th pure candlestick with all hi furniture, and the altar of incense,
31:9 and the altar of burnt offer with all hi furniture, and the
lav and hi foot, 31:10 and the cloth of service, and the holy
gar for aaron the priest, and the garment of hi sons, to
minist in the priest' office, 31:11 and the anoint oil, and
sweet incens for the holi place: accord to all that I have
command thee shall they do.

31:12 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 31:13 speak thou also
unto the children of israel, saying, verili my sabbath ye shall keep:
for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that
y may know that I am the lord that doth sanctifi you.

31:14 Ye shall keep the sabbath therefore; for it is holi unto you:
everi one that defileth it shall sure be put to death: for whosoever
doeth ani work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his
people.

31:15 six day may work be done; but in the seventh is the sabbath of
rest, holi to the lord: whosoev doeth ani work in the sabbath day,
h shall sure be put to death.

31:16 wherefor the children of israel shall keep the sabbath, to
observ the sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual
covenant.

31:17 It is a sign between me and the children of israel for ever: for
in six day the lord made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he
rested, and wa refreshed.

31:18 and he gave unto moses, when he had made an end of communing
with him upon mount sinai, two tabl of testimony, tabl of stone,
written with the finger of god.

32:1 and when the peopl saw that mose delay to come down out of
th mount, the peopl gather themselv togeth unto aaron, and
said unto him, up, make us gods, which shall go befor us; for as for
thi moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of egypt, we
wot not what is becom of him.

32:2 and aaron said unto them, break off the golden earrings, which
ar in the ear of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters,
and bring them unto me.

32:3 and all the peopl brake off the golden ear which were in
their ears, and brought them unto aaron.

32:4 and he receiv them at their hand, and fashion it with a
grav tool, after he had made it a molten calf: and they said, these
b thi gods, O israel, which brought thee up out of the land of egypt.

32:5 and when aaron saw it, he built an altar befor it; and aaron
mad proclamation, and said, To morrow is a feast to the lord.

32:6 and they rose up earli on the morrow, and offer burnt
offerings, and brought peac offerings; and the peopl sat down to eat
and to drink, and rose up to play.

32:7 and the lord said unto moses, go, get thee down; for thi people,
which thou broughtest out of the land of egypt, have corrupted
themselves: 32:8 they have turn asid quickli out of the way which i
command them: they have made them a molten calf, and have worshipped
it, and have sacrif thereunto, and said, these be thi gods, o
israel, which have brought thee up out of the land of egypt.

32:9 and the lord said unto moses, I have seen thi people, and,
behold, it is a stiffneck people: 32:10 now therefor let me alone,
that my wrath may wax hot against them, and that I may consum them:
and I will make of thee a great nation.

32:11 and mose besought the lord hi god, and said, lord, whi doth
thi wrath wax hot against thi people, which thou hast brought forth
out of the land of egypt with great power, and with a mighti hand?
32:12 wherefor should the egyptian speak, and say, for mischief did
h bring them out, to slay them in the mountains, and to consum them
from the face of the earth? turn from thi fierc wrath, and repent of
thi evil against thi people.

32:13 rememb abraham, isaac, and israel, thi servants, to whom thou
swarest by thine own self, and saidst unto them, I will multipli your
se as the star of heaven, and all thi land that I have spoken of
wil I give unto your seed, and they shall inherit it for ever.

32:14 and the lord repent of the evil which he thought to do unto
hi people.

32:15 and mose turned, and went down from the mount, and the two
tabl of the testimoni were in hi hand: the tabl were written on
both their sides; on the one side and on the other were they written.

32:16 and the tabl were the work of god, and the write wa the
writ of god, graven upon the tables.

32:17 and when joshua heard the nois of the peopl as they shouted,
h said unto moses, there is a nois of war in the camp.

32:18 and he said, It is not the voic of them that shout for mastery,
neith is it the voic of them that cri for be overcome: but the
nois of them that sing do I hear.

32:19 and it came to pass, as soon as he came nigh unto the camp, that
h saw the calf, and the dancing: and moses' anger wax hot, and he
cast the tabl out of hi hands, and brake them beneath the mount.

32:20 and he took the calf which they had made, and burnt it in the
fire, and ground it to powder, and straw it upon the water, and made
th children of israel drink of it.

32:21 and mose said unto aaron, what did thi peopl unto thee, that
thou hast brought so great a sin upon them?  32:22 and aaron said, let
not the anger of my lord wax hot: thou knowest the people, that they
ar set on mischief.

32:23 for they said unto me, make us gods, which shall go befor us:
for as for thi moses, the man that brought us up out of the land of
egypt, we wot not what is becom of him.

32:24 and I said unto them, whosoev hath ani gold, let them break it
off. So they gave it me: then I cast it into the fire, and there came
out thi calf.

32:25 and when mose saw that the peopl were naked; (for aaron had
mad them nake unto their shame among their enemies:) 32:26 then
mos stood in the gate of the camp, and said, who is on the lord's
side? let him come unto me. and all the son of levi gathered
themselv togeth unto him.

32:27 and he said unto them, thu saith the lord god of israel, put
everi man hi sword by hi side, and go in and out from gate to gate
throughout the camp, and slay everi man hi brother, and everi man his
companion, and everi man hi neighbour.

32:28 and the children of levi did accord to the word of moses: and
ther fell of the peopl that day about three thousand men.

32:29 for mose had said, consecr yourselv today to the lord,
even everi man upon hi son, and upon hi brother; that he may bestow
upon you a bless thi day.

32:30 and it came to pass on the morrow, that mose said unto the
people, Ye have sin a great sin: and now I will go up unto the
lord; peradventur I shall make an aton for your sin.

32:31 and mose return unto the lord, and said, oh, thi peopl have
sin a great sin, and have made them god of gold.

32:32 yet now, if thou wilt forgiv their sin--; and if not, blot me,
i pray thee, out of thi book which thou hast written.

32:33 and the lord said unto moses, whosoev hath sin against me,
him will I blot out of my book.

32:34 therefor now go, lead the peopl unto the place of which I have
spoken unto thee: behold, mine angel shall go befor thee:
nevertheless in the day when I visit I will visit their sin upon them.

32:35 and the lord plagu the people, becaus they made the calf,
which aaron made.

33:1 and the lord said unto moses, depart, and go up hence, thou and
th peopl which thou hast brought up out of the land of egypt, unto
th land which I sware unto abraham, to isaac, and to jacob, saying,
unto thi seed will I give it: 33:2 and I will send an angel before
thee; and I will drive out the canaanite, the amorite, and the
hittite, and the perizzite, the hivite, and the jebusite: 33:3 unto a
land flow with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of
thee; for thou art a stiffneck people: lest I consum thee in the
way.

33:4 and when the peopl heard these evil tidings, they mourned: and
no man did put on him hi ornaments.

33:5 for the lord had said unto moses, say unto the children of
israel, Ye are a stiffneck people: I will come up into the midst of
the in a moment, and consum thee: therefor now put off thy
orna from thee, that I may know what to do unto thee.

33:6 and the children of israel strip themselv of their ornaments
bi the mount horeb.

33:7 and mose took the tabernacle, and pitch it without the camp,
afar off from the camp, and call it the tabernacl of the
congregation. and it came to pass, that everi one which sought the
lord went out unto the tabernacl of the congregation, which was
without the camp.

33:8 and it came to pass, when mose went out unto the tabernacle,
that all the peopl rose up, and stood everi man at hi tent door, and
look after moses, until he wa gone into the tabernacle.

33:9 and it came to pass, as mose enter into the tabernacle, the
cloudi pillar descended, and stood at the door of the tabernacle, and
th lord talk with moses.

33:10 and all the peopl saw the cloudi pillar stand at the tabernacle
door: and all the peopl rose up and worshipped, everi man in hi tent
door.

33:11 and the lord spake unto mose face to face, as a man speaketh
unto hi friend. and he turn again into the camp: but hi servant
joshua, the son of nun, a young man, depart not out of the
tabernacle.

33:12 and mose said unto the lord, see, thou sayest unto me, bring up
thi people: and thou hast not let me know whom thou wilt send with
me. yet thou hast said, I know thee by name, and thou hast also found
grac in my sight.

33:13 now therefore, I pray thee, if I have found grace in thi sight,
shew me now thi way, that I may know thee, that I may find grace in
thi sight: and consid that thi nation is thi people.

33:14 and he said, My presenc shall go with thee, and I will give
the rest.

33:15 and he said unto him, If thi presenc go not with me, carri us
not up hence.

33:16 for wherein shall it be known here that I and thi peopl have
found grace in thi sight? is it not in that thou goest with us? so
shal we be separated, I and thi people, from all the peopl that are
upon the face of the earth.

33:17 and the lord said unto moses, I will do thi thing also that
thou hast spoken: for thou hast found grace in my sight, and I know
the by name.

33:18 and he said, I beseech thee, shew me thi glory.

33:19 and he said, I will make all my good pass befor thee, and i
wil proclaim the name of the lord befor thee; and will be gracious
to whom I will be gracious, and will shew merci on whom I will shew
mercy.

33:20 and he said, thou canst not see my face: for there shall no man
se me, and live.

33:21 and the lord said, behold, there is a place by me, and thou
shalt stand upon a rock: 33:22 and it shall come to pass, while my
glori passeth by, that I will put thee in a clift of the rock, and
wil cover thee with my hand while I pass by: 33:23 and I will take
away mine hand, and thou shalt see my back parts: but my face shall
not be seen.

34:1 and the lord said unto moses, hew thee two tabl of stone like
unto the first: and I will write upon these tabl the word that were
in the first tables, which thou brakest.

34:2 and be readi in the morning, and come up in the morn unto
mount sinai, and present thyself there to me in the top of the mount.

34:3 and no man shall come up with thee, neither let ani man be seen
throughout all the mount; neither let the flock nor herd feed before
that mount.

34:4 and he hew two tabl of stone like unto the first; and moses
ros up earli in the morning, and went up unto mount sinai, as the
lord had command him, and took in hi hand the two tabl of stone.

34:5 and the lord descend in the cloud, and stood with him there,
and proclaim the name of the lord.

34:6 and the lord pass by befor him, and proclaimed, the lord, the
lord god, merci and gracious, longsuffering, and abund in
good and truth, 34:7 keep merci for thousands, forgiving
iniqu and transgress and sin, and that will by no mean clear
th guilty; visit the iniqu of the father upon the children,
and upon the children' children, unto the third and to the fourth
generation.

34:8 and mose made haste, and bow hi head toward the earth, and
worshipped.

34:9 and he said, If now I have found grace in thi sight, O lord, let
mi lord, I pray thee, go among us; for it is a stiffneck people; and
pardon our iniqu and our sin, and take us for thine inheritance.

34:10 and he said, behold, I make a covenant: befor all thi peopl i
wil do marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth, nor in
ani nation: and all the peopl among which thou art shall see the work
of the lord: for it is a terribl thing that I will do with thee.

34:11 observ thou that which I command thee thi day: behold, I drive
out befor thee the amorite, and the canaanite, and the hittite, and
th perizzite, and the hivite, and the jebusite.

34:12 take heed to thyself, lest thou make a coven with the
inhabit of the land whither thou goest, lest it be for a snare in
th midst of thee: 34:13 but ye shall destroy their altars, break
their images, and cut down their groves: 34:14 for thou shalt worship
no other god: for the lord, whose name is jealous, is a jealou god:
34:15 lest thou make a coven with the inhabit of the land, and
they go a whore after their gods, and do sacrific unto their gods,
and one call thee, and thou eat of hi sacrifice; 34:16 and thou take
of their daughter unto thi sons, and their daughter go a whoring
aft their gods, and make thi son go a whore after their gods.

34:17 thou shalt make thee no molten gods.

34:18 the feast of unleaven bread shalt thou keep. seven day thou
shalt eat unleaven bread, as I command thee, in the time of the
month abib: for in the month abib thou camest out from egypt.

34:19 all that openeth the matrix is mine; and everi firstl among
thi cattle, whether ox or sheep, that is male.

34:20 but the firstl of an ass thou shalt redeem with a lamb: and
if thou redeem him not, then shalt thou break hi neck. all the
firstborn of thi son thou shalt redeem. and none shall appear before
m empty.

34:21 six day thou shalt work, but on the seventh day thou shalt
rest: in ear time and in harvest thou shalt rest.

34:22 and thou shalt observ the feast of weeks, of the firstfruit of
wheat harvest, and the feast of ingath at the year' end.

34:23 thrice in the year shall all your menchildren appear befor the
lord god, the god of israel.

34:24 for I will cast out the nation befor thee, and enlarg thy
borders: neither shall ani man desir thi land, when thou shalt go up
to appear befor the lord thi god thrice in the year.

34:25 thou shalt not offer the blood of my sacrific with leaven;
neith shall the sacrific of the feast of the passov be left unto
th morning.

34:26 the first of the firstfruit of thi land thou shalt bring unto
th hous of the lord thi god. thou shalt not seeth a kid in his
mother' milk.

34:27 and the lord said unto moses, write thou these words: for after
th tenor of these word I have made a coven with thee and with
israel.

34:28 and he wa there with the lord forti day and forti nights; he
did neither eat bread, nor drink water. and he wrote upon the tables
th word of the covenant, the ten commandments.

34:29 and it came to pass, when mose came down from mount sinai with
th two tabl of testimoni in moses' hand, when he came down from the
mount, that mose wist not that the skin of hi face shone while he
talk with him.

34:30 and when aaron and all the children of israel saw moses, behold,
th skin of hi face shone; and they were afraid to come nigh him.

34:31 and mose call unto them; and aaron and all the ruler of the
congreg return unto him: and mose talk with them.

34:32 and afterward all the children of israel came nigh: and he gave
them in command all that the lord had spoken with him in mount
sinai.

34:33 and till mose had done speak with them, he put a vail on his
face.

34:34 but when mose went in befor the lord to speak with him, he
took the vail off, until he came out. and he came out, and spake unto
th children of israel that which he wa commanded.

34:35 and the children of israel saw the face of moses, that the skin
of moses' face shone: and mose put the vail upon hi face again,
until he went in to speak with him.

35:1 and mose gather all the congreg of the children of israel
together, and said unto them, these are the word which the lord hath
commanded, that ye should do them.

35:2 six day shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall
b to you an holi day, a sabbath of rest to the lord: whosoev doeth
work therein shall be put to death.

35:3 Ye shall kindl no fire throughout your habit upon the
sabbath day.

35:4 and mose spake unto all the congreg of the children of
israel, saying, thi is the thing which the lord commanded, saying,
35:5 take ye from among you an offer unto the lord: whosoev is of
a will heart, let him bring it, an offer of the lord; gold, and
silver, and brass, 35:6 and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine
linen, and goats' hair, 35:7 and rams' skin dy red, and badgers'
skins, and shittim wood, 35:8 and oil for the light, and spice for
anoint oil, and for the sweet incense, 35:9 and onyx stones, and
ston to be set for the ephod, and for the breastplate.

35:10 and everi wise heart among you shall come, and make all that
th lord hath commanded; 35:11 the tabernacle, hi tent, and his
covering, hi taches, and hi boards, hi bars, hi pillars, and his
sockets, 35:12 the ark, and the stave thereof, with the merci seat,
and the vail of the covering, 35:13 the table, and hi staves, and all
hi vessels, and the shewbread, 35:14 the candlestick also for the
light, and hi furniture, and hi lamps, with the oil for the light,
35:15 and the incens altar, and hi staves, and the anoint oil,
and the sweet incense, and the hang for the door at the enter in
of the tabernacle, 35:16 the altar of burnt offering, with hi brasen
grate, hi staves, and all hi vessels, the laver and hi foot, 35:17
the hang of the court, hi pillars, and their sockets, and the
hang for the door of the court, 35:18 the pin of the tabernacle,
and the pin of the court, and their cords, 35:19 the cloth of
service, to do servic in the holi place, the holi garment for aaron
th priest, and the garment of hi sons, to minist in the priest's
office.

35:20 and all the congreg of the children of israel depart from
th presenc of moses.

35:21 and they came, everi one whose heart stir him up, and every
on whom hi spirit made willing, and they brought the lord' offering
to the work of the tabernacl of the congregation, and for all his
service, and for the holi garments.

35:22 and they came, both men and women, as mani as were willing
hearted, and brought bracelets, and earrings, and rings, and tablets,
al jewel of gold: and everi man that offer offer an offer of
gold unto the lord.

35:23 and everi man, with whom wa found blue, and purple, and
scarlet, and fine linen, and goats' hair, and red skin of rams, and
badgers' skins, brought them.

35:24 everi one that did offer an offer of silver and brass brought
th lord' offering: and everi man, with whom wa found shittim wood
for ani work of the service, brought it.

35:25 and all the women that were wise heart did spin with their
hands, and brought that which they had spun, both of blue, and of
purple, and of scarlet, and of fine linen.

35:26 and all the women whose heart stir them up in wisdom spun
goats' hair.

35:27 and the ruler brought onyx stones, and stone to be set, for
th ephod, and for the breastplate; 35:28 and spice, and oil for the
light, and for the anoint oil, and for the sweet incense.

35:29 the children of israel brought a will offer unto the lord,
everi man and woman, whose heart made them will to bring for all
mann of work, which the lord had command to be made by the hand of
moses.

35:30 and mose said unto the children of israel, see, the lord hath
cal by name bezaleel the son of uri, the son of hur, of the tribe
of judah; 35:31 and he hath fill him with the spirit of god, in
wisdom, in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of
workmanship; 35:32 and to devis curiou works, to work in gold, and
in silver, and in brass, 35:33 and in the cut of stones, to set
them, and in carv of wood, to make ani manner of cun work.

35:34 and he hath put in hi heart that he may teach, both he, and
aholiab, the son of ahisamach, of the tribe of dan.

35:35 them hath he fill with wisdom of heart, to work all manner of
work, of the engraver, and of the cun workman, and of the
embroiderer, in blue, and in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen,
and of the weaver, even of them that do ani work, and of those that
devis cun work.

36:1 then wrought bezaleel and aholiab, and everi wise heart man, in
whom the lord put wisdom and understand to know how to work all
mann of work for the servic of the sanctuary, accord to all that
th lord had commanded.

36:2 and mose call bezaleel and aholiab, and everi wise hearted
man, in whose heart the lord had put wisdom, even everi one whose
heart stir him up to come unto the work to do it: 36:3 and they
receiv of mose all the offering, which the children of israel had
brought for the work of the servic of the sanctuary, to make it
withal. and they brought yet unto him free offer everi morning.

36:4 and all the wise men, that wrought all the work of the sanctuary,
cam everi man from hi work which they made; 36:5 and they spake unto
moses, saying, the peopl bring much more than enough for the service
of the work, which the lord command to make.

36:6 and mose gave commandment, and they caus it to be proclaimed
throughout the camp, saying, let neither man nor woman make ani more
work for the offer of the sanctuary. So the peopl were restrained
from bringing.

36:7 for the stuff they had wa suffici for all the work to make
it, and too much.

36:8 and everi wise heart man among them that wrought the work of
th tabernacl made ten curtain of fine twine linen, and blue, and
purple, and scarlet: with cherubim of cun work made he them.

36:9 the length of one curtain wa twenti and eight cubits, and the
breadth of one curtain four cubits: the curtain were all of one size.

36:10 and he coupl the five curtain one unto another: and the other
f curtain he coupl one unto another.

36:11 and he made loop of blue on the edg of one curtain from the
selvedg in the coupling: likewis he made in the uttermost side of
anoth curtain, in the coupl of the second.

36:12 fifti loop made he in one curtain, and fifti loop made he in
th edg of the curtain which wa in the coupl of the second: the
loop held one curtain to another.

36:13 and he made fifti tach of gold, and coupl the curtain one
unto anoth with the taches: so it becam one tabernacle.

36:14 and he made curtain of goats' hair for the tent over the
tabernacle: eleven curtain he made them.

36:15 the length of one curtain wa thirti cubits, and four cubit was
th breadth of one curtain: the eleven curtain were of one size.

36:16 and he coupl five curtain by themselves, and six curtain by
themselves.

36:17 and he made fifti loop upon the uttermost edg of the curtain
in the coupling, and fifti loop made he upon the edg of the curtain
which coupleth the second.

36:18 and he made fifti tach of brass to coupl the tent together,
that it might be one.

36:19 and he made a cover for the tent of rams' skin dy red, and
a cover of badgers' skin abov that.

36:20 and he made board for the tabernacl of shittim wood, standing
up.

36:21 the length of a board wa ten cubits, and the breadth of a board
on cubit and a half.

36:22 one board had two tenons, equal distant one from another: thus
did he make for all the board of the tabernacle.

36:23 and he made board for the tabernacle; twenti board for the
south side southward: 36:24 and forti socket of silver he made under
th twenti boards; two socket under one board for hi two tenons, and
two socket under anoth board for hi two tenons.

36:25 and for the other side of the tabernacle, which is toward the
north corner, he made twenti boards, 36:26 and their forti socket of
silver; two socket under one board, and two socket under another
board.

36:27 and for the side of the tabernacl westward he made six boards.

36:28 and two board made he for the corner of the tabernacl in the
two sides.

36:29 and they were coupl beneath, and coupl togeth at the head
thereof, to one ring: thu he did to both of them in both the corners.

36:30 and there were eight boards; and their socket were sixteen
socket of silver, under everi board two sockets.

36:31 and he made bar of shittim wood; five for the board of the one
sid of the tabernacle, 36:32 and five bar for the board of the
oth side of the tabernacle, and five bar for the board of the
tabernacl for the side westward.

36:33 and he made the middl bar to shoot through the board from the
on end to the other.

36:34 and he overlaid the board with gold, and made their ring of
gold to be place for the bars, and overlaid the bar with gold.

36:35 and he made a vail of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine
twin linen: with cherubim made he it of cun work.

36:36 and he made thereunto four pillar of shittim wood, and overlaid
them with gold: their hook were of gold; and he cast for them four
socket of silver.

36:37 and he made an hang for the tabernacl door of blue, and
purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen, of needlework; 36:38 and
th five pillar of it with their hooks: and he overlaid their
chapit and their fillet with gold: but their five socket were of
brass.

37:1 and bezaleel made the ark of shittim wood: two cubit and a half
wa the length of it, and a cubit and a half the breadth of it, and a
cubit and a half the height of it: 37:2 and he overlaid it with pure
gold within and without, and made a crown of gold to it round about.

37:3 and he cast for it four ring of gold, to be set by the four
corn of it; even two ring upon the one side of it, and two rings
upon the other side of it.

37:4 and he made stave of shittim wood, and overlaid them with gold.

37:5 and he put the stave into the ring by the side of the ark, to
bear the ark.

37:6 and he made the merci seat of pure gold: two cubit and a half
wa the length thereof, and one cubit and a half the breadth thereof.

37:7 and he made two cherubim of gold, beaten out of one piec made
h them, on the two end of the merci seat; 37:8 one cherub on the end
on thi side, and anoth cherub on the other end on that side: out of
th merci seat made he the cherubim on the two end thereof.

37:9 and the cherubim spread out their wing on high, and covered
with their wing over the merci seat, with their face one to another;
even to the merci seatward were the face of the cherubims.

37:10 and he made the tabl of shittim wood: two cubit wa the length
thereof, and a cubit the breadth thereof, and a cubit and a half the
height thereof: 37:11 and he overlaid it with pure gold, and made
thereunto a crown of gold round about.

37:12 also he made thereunto a border of an handbreadth round about;
and made a crown of gold for the border thereof round about.

37:13 and he cast for it four ring of gold, and put the ring upon
th four corner that were in the four feet thereof.

37:14 over against the border were the rings, the place for the
stav to bear the table.

37:15 and he made the stave of shittim wood, and overlaid them with
gold, to bear the table.

37:16 and he made the vessel which were upon the table, hi dishes,
and hi spoons, and hi bowls, and hi cover to cover withal, of pure
gold.

37:17 and he made the candlestick of pure gold: of beaten work made he
th candlestick; hi shaft, and hi branch, hi bowls, hi knops, and
hi flowers, were of the same: 37:18 and six branch go out of the
sid thereof; three branch of the candlestick out of the one side
thereof, and three branch of the candlestick out of the other side
thereof: 37:19 three bowl made after the fashion of almond in one
branch, a knop and a flower; and three bowl made like almond in
anoth branch, a knop and a flower: so throughout the six branches
go out of the candlestick.

37:20 and in the candlestick were four bowl made like almonds, his
knops, and hi flowers: 37:21 and a knop under two branch of the
same, and a knop under two branch of the same, and a knop under two
branch of the same, accord to the six branch go out of it.

37:22 their knop and their branch were of the same: all of it was
on beaten work of pure gold.

37:23 and he made hi seven lamps, and hi snuffers, and his
snuffdishes, of pure gold.

37:24 Of a talent of pure gold made he it, and all the vessels
thereof.

37:25 and he made the incens altar of shittim wood: the length of it
wa a cubit, and the breadth of it a cubit; it wa foursquare; and two
cubit wa the height of it; the horn thereof were of the same.

37:26 and he overlaid it with pure gold, both the top of it, and the
sid thereof round about, and the horn of it: also he made unto it a
crown of gold round about.

37:27 and he made two ring of gold for it under the crown thereof, by
th two corner of it, upon the two side thereof, to be place for
th stave to bear it withal.

37:28 and he made the stave of shittim wood, and overlaid them with
gold.

37:29 and he made the holi anoint oil, and the pure incens of
sweet spices, accord to the work of the apothecary.

38:1 and he made the altar of burnt offer of shittim wood: five
cubit wa the length thereof, and five cubit the breadth thereof; it
wa foursquare; and three cubit the height thereof.

38:2 and he made the horn thereof on the four corner of it; the
horn thereof were of the same: and he overlaid it with brass.

38:3 and he made all the vessel of the altar, the pots, and the
shovels, and the basons, and the fleshhooks, and the firepans: all the
vessel thereof made he of brass.

38:4 and he made for the altar a brasen grate of network under the
compass thereof beneath unto the midst of it.

38:5 and he cast four ring for the four end of the grate of brass,
to be place for the staves.

38:6 and he made the stave of shittim wood, and overlaid them with
brass.

38:7 and he put the stave into the ring on the side of the altar,
to bear it withal; he made the altar hollow with boards.

38:8 and he made the laver of brass, and the foot of it of brass, of
th lookingglass of the women assembling, which assembl at the
door of the tabernacl of the congregation.

38:9 and he made the court: on the south side southward the hangings
of the court were of fine twine linen, an hundr cubits: 38:10 their
pillar were twenty, and their brasen socket twenty; the hook of the
pillar and their fillet were of silver.

38:11 and for the north side the hang were an hundr cubits,
their pillar were twenty, and their socket of brass twenty; the
hook of the pillar and their fillet of silver.

38:12 and for the west side were hang of fifti cubits, their
pillar ten, and their socket ten; the hook of the pillar and their
fillet of silver.

38:13 and for the east side eastward fifti cubits.

38:14 the hang of the one side of the gate were fifteen cubits;
their pillar three, and their socket three.

38:15 and for the other side of the court gate, on thi hand and that
hand, were hang of fifteen cubits; their pillar three, and their
socket three.

38:16 all the hang of the court round about were of fine twined
linen.

38:17 and the socket for the pillar were of brass; the hook of the
pillar and their fillet of silver; and the overlay of their
chapit of silver; and all the pillar of the court were filleted
with silver.

38:18 and the hang for the gate of the court wa needlework, of
blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen: and twenty
cubit wa the length, and the height in the breadth wa five cubits,
answer to the hang of the court.

38:19 and their pillar were four, and their socket of brass four;
their hook of silver, and the overlay of their chapit and their
fillet of silver.

38:20 and all the pin of the tabernacle, and of the court round
about, were of brass.

38:21 thi is the sum of the tabernacle, even of the tabernacl of
testimony, as it wa counted, accord to the command of moses,
for the servic of the levites, by the hand of ithamar, son to aaron
th priest.

38:22 and bezaleel the son uri, the son of hur, of the tribe of judah,
mad all that the lord command moses.

38:23 and with him wa aholiab, son of ahisamach, of the tribe of dan,
an engraver, and a cun workman, and an embroider in blue, and in
purple, and in scarlet, and fine linen.

38:24 all the gold that wa occupi for the work in all the work of
th holi place, even the gold of the offering, wa twenti and nine
talents, and seven hundr and thirti shekels, after the shekel of the
sanctuary.

38:25 and the silver of them that were number of the congregation
wa an hundr talents, and a thousand seven hundr and threescore
and fifteen shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary: 38:26 A bekah
for everi man, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the
sanctuary, for everi one that went to be numbered, from twenti years
old and upward, for six hundr thousand and three thousand and five
hundr and fifti men.

38:27 and of the hundr talent of silver were cast the socket of
th sanctuary, and the socket of the vail; an hundr socket of the
hundr talents, a talent for a socket.

38:28 and of the thousand seven hundr seventi and five shekel he
mad hook for the pillars, and overlaid their chapiters, and filleted
them.

38:29 and the brass of the offer wa seventi talents, and two
thousand and four hundr shekels.

38:30 and therewith he made the socket to the door of the tabernacle
of the congregation, and the brasen altar, and the brasen grate for
it, and all the vessel of the altar, 38:31 and the socket of the
court round about, and the socket of the court gate, and all the pins
of the tabernacle, and all the pin of the court round about.

39:1 and of the blue, and purple, and scarlet, they made cloth of
service, to do servic in the holi place, and made the holi garments
for aaron; as the lord command moses.

39:2 and he made the ephod of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and
fin twine linen.

39:3 and they did beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into
wires, to work it in the blue, and in the purple, and in the scarlet,
and in the fine linen, with cun work.

39:4 they made shoulderpiec for it, to coupl it together: by the
two edg wa it coupl together.

39:5 and the curiou girdl of hi ephod, that wa upon it, wa of the
same, accord to the work thereof; of gold, blue, and purple, and
scarlet, and fine twine linen; as the lord command moses.

39:6 and they wrought onyx stone inclos in ouch of gold, graven,
a signet are graven, with the name of the children of israel.

39:7 and he put them on the shoulder of the ephod, that they should
b stone for a memori to the children of israel; as the lord
command moses.

39:8 and he made the breastplat of cun work, like the work of the
ephod; of gold, blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twine linen.

39:9 It wa foursquare; they made the breastplat double: a span was
th length thereof, and a span the breadth thereof, be doubled.

39:10 and they set in it four row of stones: the first row wa a
sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: thi wa the first row.

39:11 and the second row, an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

39:12 and the third row, a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.

39:13 and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper: they were
inclos in ouch of gold in their inclosings.

39:14 and the stone were accord to the name of the children of
israel, twelve, accord to their names, like the engrav of a
signet, everi one with hi name, accord to the twelv tribes.

39:15 and they made upon the breastplat chain at the ends, of
wreathen work of pure gold.

39:16 and they made two ouch of gold, and two gold rings; and put
th two ring in the two end of the breastplate.

39:17 and they put the two wreathen chain of gold in the two ring on
th end of the breastplate.

39:18 and the two end of the two wreathen chain they fasten in the
two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpiec of the ephod, before
it.

39:19 and they made two ring of gold, and put them on the two end of
th breastplate, upon the border of it, which wa on the side of the
ephod inward.

39:20 and they made two other golden rings, and put them on the two
sid of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart of it, over against
th other coupl thereof, abov the curiou girdl of the ephod.

39:21 and they did bind the breastplat by hi ring unto the ring of
th ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be abov the curious
girdl of the ephod, and that the breastplat might not be loos from
th ephod; as the lord command moses.

39:22 and he made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.

39:23 and there wa an hole in the midst of the robe, as the hole of
an habergeon, with a band round about the hole, that it should not
rend.

39:24 and they made upon the hem of the robe pomegran of blue,
and purple, and scarlet, and twine linen.

39:25 and they made bell of pure gold, and put the bell between the
pomegran upon the hem of the robe, round about between the
pomegranates; 39:26 A bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a
pomegranate, round about the hem of the robe to minist in; as the
lord command moses.

39:27 and they made coat of fine linen of woven work for aaron, and
for hi sons, 39:28 and a mitr of fine linen, and goodli bonnet of
fin linen, and linen breech of fine twine linen, 39:29 and a
girdl of fine twine linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, of
needlework; as the lord command moses.

39:30 and they made the plate of the holi crown of pure gold, and
wrot upon it a writing, like to the engrav of a signet, holiness
to the lord.

39:31 and they tie unto it a lace of blue, to fasten it on high upon
th mitre; as the lord command moses.

39:32 thu wa all the work of the tabernacl of the tent of the
congreg finished: and the children of israel did accord to all
that the lord command moses, so did they.

39:33 and they brought the tabernacl unto moses, the tent, and all
hi furniture, hi taches, hi boards, hi bars, and hi pillars, and
hi sockets, 39:34 and the cover of rams' skin dy red, and the
cov of badgers' skins, and the vail of the covering, 39:35 the
ark of the testimony, and the stave thereof, and the merci seat,
39:36 the table, and all the vessel thereof, and the shewbread, 39:37
the pure candlestick, with the lamp thereof, even with the lamp to
b set in order, and all the vessel thereof, and the oil for light,
39:38 and the golden altar, and the anoint oil, and the sweet
incense, and the hang for the tabernacl door, 39:39 the brasen
altar, and hi grate of brass, hi staves, and all hi vessels, the
lav and hi foot, 39:40 the hang of the court, hi pillars, and
hi sockets, and the hang for the court gate, hi cords, and his
pins, and all the vessel of the servic of the tabernacle, for the
tent of the congregation, 39:41 the cloth of servic to do servic in
th holi place, and the holi garment for aaron the priest, and his
sons' garments, to minist in the priest' office.

39:42 accord to all that the lord command moses, so the children
of israel made all the work.

39:43 and mose did look upon all the work, and, behold, they had done
it as the lord had commanded, even so had they done it: and moses
bless them.

40:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 40:2 On the first day of
th first month shalt thou set up the tabernacl of the tent of the
congregation.

40:3 and thou shalt put therein the ark of the testimony, and cover
th ark with the vail.

40:4 and thou shalt bring in the table, and set in order the things
that are to be set in order upon it; and thou shalt bring in the
candlestick, and light the lamp thereof.

40:5 and thou shalt set the altar of gold for the incens befor the
ark of the testimony, and put the hang of the door to the
tabernacle.

40:6 and thou shalt set the altar of the burnt offer befor the
door of the tabernacl of the tent of the congregation.

40:7 and thou shalt set the laver between the tent of the congregation
and the altar, and shalt put water therein.

40:8 and thou shalt set up the court round about, and hang up the
hang at the court gate.

40:9 and thou shalt take the anoint oil, and anoint the tabernacle,
and all that is therein, and shalt hallow it, and all the vessels
thereof: and it shall be holy.

40:10 and thou shalt anoint the altar of the burnt offering, and all
hi vessels, and sanctifi the altar: and it shall be an altar most
holy.

40:11 and thou shalt anoint the laver and hi foot, and sanctifi it.

40:12 and thou shalt bring aaron and hi son unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation, and wash them with water.

40:13 and thou shalt put upon aaron the holi garments, and anoint him,
and sanctifi him; that he may minist unto me in the priest' office.

40:14 and thou shalt bring hi sons, and cloth them with coats: 40:15
and thou shalt anoint them, as thou didst anoint their father, that
they may minist unto me in the priest' office: for their anointing
shal sure be an everlast priesthood throughout their
generations.

40:16 thu did moses: accord to all that the lord command him, so
did he.

40:17 and it came to pass in the first month in the second year, on
th first day of the month, that the tabernacl wa rear up.

40:18 and mose rear up the tabernacle, and fasten hi sockets,
and set up the board thereof, and put in the bar thereof, and reared
up hi pillars.

40:19 and he spread abroad the tent over the tabernacle, and put the
cov of the tent abov upon it; as the lord command moses.

40:20 and he took and put the testimoni into the ark, and set the
stav on the ark, and put the merci seat abov upon the ark: 40:21
and he brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the vail of the
covering, and cover the ark of the testimony; as the lord commanded
moses.

40:22 and he put the tabl in the tent of the congregation, upon the
sid of the tabernacl northward, without the vail.

40:23 and he set the bread in order upon it befor the lord; as the
lord had command moses.

40:24 and he put the candlestick in the tent of the congregation, over
against the table, on the side of the tabernacl southward.

40:25 and he light the lamp befor the lord; as the lord commanded
moses.

40:26 and he put the golden altar in the tent of the congregation
befor the vail: 40:27 and he burnt sweet incens thereon; as the lord
command moses.

40:28 and he set up the hang at the door of the tabernacle.

40:29 and he put the altar of burnt offer by the door of the
tabernacl of the tent of the congregation, and offer upon it the
burnt offer and the meat offering; as the lord command moses.

40:30 and he set the laver between the tent of the congreg and
th altar, and put water there, to wash withal.

40:31 and mose and aaron and hi son wash their hand and their
feet thereat: 40:32 when they went into the tent of the congregation,
and when they came near unto the altar, they washed; as the lord
command moses.

40:33 and he rear up the court round about the tabernacl and the
altar, and set up the hang of the court gate. So mose finish the
work.

40:34 then a cloud cover the tent of the congregation, and the glory
of the lord fill the tabernacle.

40:35 and mose wa not abl to enter into the tent of the
congregation, becaus the cloud abod thereon, and the glori of the
lord fill the tabernacle.

40:36 and when the cloud wa taken up from over the tabernacle, the
children of israel went onward in all their journeys: 40:37 but if the
cloud were not taken up, then they journey not till the day that it
wa taken up.

40:38 for the cloud of the lord wa upon the tabernacl by day, and
fir wa on it by night, in the sight of all the hous of israel,
throughout all their journeys.




th third book of moses:  call leviticus


1:1 and the lord call unto moses, and spake unto him out of the
tabernacl of the congregation, saying, 1:2 speak unto the children of
israel, and say unto them, If ani man of you bring an offer unto
th lord, ye shall bring your offer of the cattle, even of the
herd, and of the flock.

1:3 If hi offer be a burnt sacrific of the herd, let him offer a
mal without blemish: he shall offer it of hi own voluntari will at
th door of the tabernacl of the congreg befor the lord.

1:4 and he shall put hi hand upon the head of the burnt offering; and
it shall be accept for him to make aton for him.

1:5 and he shall kill the bullock befor the lord: and the priests,
aaron' sons, shall bring the blood, and sprinkl the blood round
about upon the altar that is by the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation.

1:6 and he shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into hi pieces.

1:7 and the son of aaron the priest shall put fire upon the altar,
and lay the wood in order upon the fire: 1:8 and the priests, aaron's
sons, shall lay the parts, the head, and the fat, in order upon the
wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar: 1:9 but hi inwards
and hi leg shall he wash in water: and the priest shall burn all on
th altar, to be a burnt sacrifice, an offer made by fire, of a
sweet savour unto the lord.

1:10 and if hi offer be of the flocks, namely, of the sheep, or of
th goats, for a burnt sacrifice; he shall bring it a male without
blemish.

1:11 and he shall kill it on the side of the altar northward before
th lord: and the priests, aaron' sons, shall sprinkl hi blood
round about upon the altar.

1:12 and he shall cut it into hi pieces, with hi head and hi fat:
and the priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire
which is upon the altar: 1:13 but he shall wash the inward and the
leg with water: and the priest shall bring it all, and burn it upon
th altar: it is a burnt sacrifice, an offer made by fire, of a
sweet savour unto the lord.

1:14 and if the burnt sacrific for hi offer to the lord be of
fowls, then he shall bring hi offer of turtledoves, or of young
pigeons.

1:15 and the priest shall bring it unto the altar, and wring off his
head, and burn it on the altar; and the blood thereof shall be wrung
out at the side of the altar: 1:16 and he shall pluck away hi crop
with hi feathers, and cast it besid the altar on the east part, by
th place of the ashes: 1:17 and he shall cleav it with the wings
thereof, but shall not divid it asunder: and the priest shall burn it
upon the altar, upon the wood that is upon the fire: it is a burnt
sacrifice, an offer made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord.

2:1 and when ani will offer a meat offer unto the lord, his
off shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil upon it, and
put frankincens thereon: 2:2 and he shall bring it to aaron' sons
th priests: and he shall take thereout hi hand of the flour
thereof, and of the oil thereof, with all the frankincens thereof;
and the priest shall burn the memori of it upon the altar, to be an
off made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord: 2:3 and the
remn of the meat offer shall be aaron' and hi sons': it is a
th most holi of the offer of the lord made by fire.

2:4 and if thou bring an oblat of a meat offer baken in the
oven, it shall be unleaven cake of fine flour mingl with oil, or
unleaven wafer anoint with oil.

2:5 and if thi oblat be a meat offer baken in a pan, it shall be
of fine flour unleavened, mingl with oil.

2:6 thou shalt part it in pieces, and pour oil thereon: it is a meat
offering.

2:7 and if thi oblat be a meat offer baken in the fryingpan, it
shal be made of fine flour with oil.

2:8 and thou shalt bring the meat offer that is made of these
th unto the lord: and when it is present unto the priest, he
shal bring it unto the altar.

2:9 and the priest shall take from the meat offer a memorial
thereof, and shall burn it upon the altar: it is an offer made by
fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord.

2:10 and that which is left of the meat offer shall be aaron' and
hi sons': it is a thing most holi of the offer of the lord made
bi fire.

2:11 No meat offering, which ye shall bring unto the lord, shall be
mad with leaven: for ye shall burn no leaven, nor ani honey, in any
off of the lord made by fire.

2:12 As for the oblat of the firstfruits, ye shall offer them unto
th lord: but they shall not be burnt on the altar for a sweet savour.

2:13 and everi oblat of thi meat offer shalt thou season with
salt; neither shalt thou suffer the salt of the coven of thi god to
b lack from thi meat offering: with all thine offer thou shalt
off salt.

2:14 and if thou offer a meat offer of thi firstfruit unto the
lord, thou shalt offer for the meat offer of thi firstfruit green
ear of corn dri by the fire, even corn beaten out of full ears.

2:15 and thou shalt put oil upon it, and lay frankincens thereon: it
i a meat offering.

2:16 and the priest shall burn the memori of it, part of the beaten
corn thereof, and part of the oil thereof, with all the frankincense
thereof: it is an offer made by fire unto the lord.

3:1 and if hi oblat be a sacrific of peac offering, if he offer
it of the herd; whether it be a male or female, he shall offer it
without blemish befor the lord.

3:2 and he shall lay hi hand upon the head of hi offering, and kill
it at the door of the tabernacl of the congregation: and aaron' sons
th priest shall sprinkl the blood upon the altar round about.

3:3 and he shall offer of the sacrific of the peac offer an
off made by fire unto the lord; the fat that covereth the
inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards, 3:4 and the two
kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the
caul abov the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away.

3:5 and aaron' son shall burn it on the altar upon the burnt
sacrifice, which is upon the wood that is on the fire: it is an
off made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord.

3:6 and if hi offer for a sacrific of peac offer unto the
lord be of the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without
blemish.

3:7 If he offer a lamb for hi offering, then shall he offer it before
th lord.

3:8 and he shall lay hi hand upon the head of hi offering, and kill
it befor the tabernacl of the congregation: and aaron' son shall
sprinkl the blood thereof round about upon the altar.

3:9 and he shall offer of the sacrific of the peac offer an
off made by fire unto the lord; the fat thereof, and the whole
rump, it shall he take off hard by the backbone; and the fat that
covereth the inwards, and all the fat that is upon the inwards, 3:10
and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon them, which is by the
flanks, and the caul abov the liver, with the kidneys, it shall he
tak away.

3:11 and the priest shall burn it upon the altar: it is the food of
th offer made by fire unto the lord.

3:12 and if hi offer be a goat, then he shall offer it befor the
lord.

3:13 and he shall lay hi hand upon the head of it, and kill it before
th tabernacl of the congregation: and the son of aaron shall
sprinkl the blood thereof upon the altar round about.

3:14 and he shall offer thereof hi offering, even an offer made by
fir unto the lord; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat
that is upon the inwards, 3:15 and the two kidneys, and the fat that
i upon them, which is by the flanks, and the caul abov the liver,
with the kidneys, it shall he take away.

3:16 and the priest shall burn them upon the altar: it is the food of
th offer made by fire for a sweet savour: all the fat is the
lord's.

3:17 It shall be a perpetu statut for your gener throughout
al your dwellings, that ye eat neither fat nor blood.

4:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 4:2 speak unto the children
of israel, saying, If a soul shall sin through ignor against any
of the command of the lord concern thing which ought not to
b done, and shall do against ani of them: 4:3 If the priest that is
anoint do sin accord to the sin of the people; then let him bring
for hi sin, which he hath sinned, a young bullock without blemish
unto the lord for a sin offering.

4:4 and he shall bring the bullock unto the door of the tabernacl of
th congreg befor the lord; and shall lay hi hand upon the
bullock' head, and kill the bullock befor the lord.

4:5 and the priest that is anoint shall take of the bullock' blood,
and bring it to the tabernacl of the congregation: 4:6 and the priest
shal dip hi finger in the blood, and sprinkl of the blood seven
tim befor the lord, befor the vail of the sanctuary.

4:7 and the priest shall put some of the blood upon the horn of the
altar of sweet incens befor the lord, which is in the tabernacl of
th congregation; and shall pour all the blood of the bullock at the
bottom of the altar of the burnt offering, which is at the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation.

4:8 and he shall take off from it all the fat of the bullock for the
sin offering; the fat that covereth the inwards, and all the fat that
i upon the inwards, 4:9 and the two kidneys, and the fat that is upon
them, which is by the flanks, and the caul abov the liver, with the
kidneys, it shall he take away, 4:10 As it wa taken off from the
bullock of the sacrific of peac offerings: and the priest shall burn
them upon the altar of the burnt offering.

4:11 and the skin of the bullock, and all hi flesh, with hi head,
and with hi legs, and hi inwards, and hi dung, 4:12 even the whole
bullock shall he carri forth without the camp unto a clean place,
wher the ash are pour out, and burn him on the wood with fire:
wher the ash are pour out shall he be burnt.

4:13 and if the whole congreg of israel sin through ignorance,
and the thing be hid from the eye of the assembly, and they have done
somewhat against ani of the command of the lord concern things
which should not be done, and are guilty; 4:14 when the sin, which
they have sin against it, is known, then the congreg shall
off a young bullock for the sin, and bring him befor the tabernacle
of the congregation.

4:15 and the elder of the congreg shall lay their hand upon the
head of the bullock befor the lord: and the bullock shall be killed
befor the lord.

4:16 and the priest that is anoint shall bring of the bullock's
blood to the tabernacl of the congregation: 4:17 and the priest shall
dip hi finger in some of the blood, and sprinkl it seven times
befor the lord, even befor the vail.

4:18 and he shall put some of the blood upon the horn of the altar
which is befor the lord, that is in the tabernacl of the
congregation, and shall pour out all the blood at the bottom of the
altar of the burnt offering, which is at the door of the tabernacl of
th congregation.

4:19 and he shall take all hi fat from him, and burn it upon the
altar.

4:20 and he shall do with the bullock as he did with the bullock for a
sin offering, so shall he do with this: and the priest shall make an
aton for them, and it shall be forgiven them.

4:21 and he shall carri forth the bullock without the camp, and burn
him as he burn the first bullock: it is a sin offer for the
congregation.

4:22 when a ruler hath sinned, and done somewhat through ignorance
against ani of the command of the lord hi god concern things
which should not be done, and is guilty; 4:23 Or if hi sin, wherein
h hath sinned, come to hi knowledge; he shall bring hi offering, a
kid of the goats, a male without blemish: 4:24 and he shall lay his
hand upon the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they
kil the burnt offer befor the lord: it is a sin offering.

4:25 and the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offer with
hi finger, and put it upon the horn of the altar of burnt offering,
and shall pour out hi blood at the bottom of the altar of burnt
offering.

4:26 and he shall burn all hi fat upon the altar, as the fat of the
sacrific of peac offerings: and the priest shall make an atonement
for him as concern hi sin, and it shall be forgiven him.

4:27 and if ani one of the common peopl sin through ignorance, while
h doeth somewhat against ani of the command of the lord
concern thing which ought not to be done, and be guilty; 4:28 or
if hi sin, which he hath sinned, come to hi knowledge: then he shall
br hi offering, a kid of the goats, a femal without blemish, for
hi sin which he hath sinned.

4:29 and he shall lay hi hand upon the head of the sin offering, and
slay the sin offer in the place of the burnt offering.

4:30 and the priest shall take of the blood thereof with hi finger,
and put it upon the horn of the altar of burnt offering, and shall
pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar.

4:31 and he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat is taken
away from off the sacrific of peac offerings; and the priest shall
burn it upon the altar for a sweet savour unto the lord; and the
priest shall make an aton for him, and it shall be forgiven him.

4:32 and if he bring a lamb for a sin offering, he shall bring it a
femal without blemish.

4:33 and he shall lay hi hand upon the head of the sin offering, and
slay it for a sin offer in the place where they kill the burnt
offering.

4:34 and the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offer with
hi finger, and put it upon the horn of the altar of burnt offering,
and shall pour out all the blood thereof at the bottom of the altar:
4:35 and he shall take away all the fat thereof, as the fat of the
lamb is taken away from the sacrific of the peac offerings; and the
priest shall burn them upon the altar, accord to the offer made
bi fire unto the lord: and the priest shall make an aton for his
sin that he hath committed, and it shall be forgiven him.

5:1 and if a soul sin, and hear the voic of swearing, and is a
witness, whether he hath seen or known of it; if he do not utter it,
then he shall bear hi iniquity.

5:2 Or if a soul touch ani unclean thing, whether it be a carcas of
an unclean beast, or a carcas of unclean cattle, or the carcas of
unclean creep things, and if it be hidden from him; he also shall
b unclean, and guilty.

5:3 Or if he touch the unclean of man, whatsoev unclean it
b that a man shall be defil withal, and it be hid from him; when he
knoweth of it, then he shall be guilty.

5:4 Or if a soul swear, pronounc with hi lip to do evil, or to do
good, whatsoev it be that a man shall pronounc with an oath, and it
b hid from him; when he knoweth of it, then he shall be guilti in one
of these.

5:5 and it shall be, when he shall be guilti in one of these things,
that he shall confess that he hath sin in that thing: 5:6 and he
shal bring hi trespass offer unto the lord for hi sin which he
hath sinned, a femal from the flock, a lamb or a kid of the goats,
for a sin offering; and the priest shall make an aton for him
concern hi sin.

5:7 and if he be not abl to bring a lamb, then he shall bring for his
trespass, which he hath committed, two turtledoves, or two young
pigeons, unto the lord; one for a sin offering, and the other for a
burnt offering.

5:8 and he shall bring them unto the priest, who shall offer that
which is for the sin offer first, and wring off hi head from his
neck, but shall not divid it asunder: 5:9 and he shall sprinkl of
th blood of the sin offer upon the side of the altar; and the rest
of the blood shall be wrung out at the bottom of the altar: it is a
sin offering.

5:10 and he shall offer the second for a burnt offering, accord to
th manner: and the priest shall make an aton for him for hi sin
which he hath sinned, and it shall be forgiven him.

5:11 but if he be not abl to bring two turtledoves, or two young
pigeons, then he that sin shall bring for hi offer the tenth
part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering; he shall put no oil
upon it, neither shall he put ani frankincens thereon: for it is a
sin offering.

5:12 then shall he bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take
hi hand of it, even a memori thereof, and burn it on the altar,
accord to the offer made by fire unto the lord: it is a sin
offering.

5:13 and the priest shall make an aton for him as touch his
sin that he hath sin in one of these, and it shall be forgiven him:
and the remnant shall be the priest's, as a meat offering.

5:14 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 5:15 If a soul commit a
trespass, and sin through ignorance, in the holi thing of the lord;
then he shall bring for hi trespass unto the lord a ram without
blemish out of the flocks, with thi estim by shekel of silver,
aft the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

5:16 and he shall make amend for the harm that he hath done in the
holi thing, and shall add the fifth part thereto, and give it unto the
priest: and the priest shall make an aton for him with the ram of
th trespass offering, and it shall be forgiven him.

5:17 and if a soul sin, and commit ani of these thing which are
forbidden to be done by the command of the lord; though he wist
it not, yet is he guilty, and shall bear hi iniquity.

5:18 and he shall bring a ram without blemish out of the flock, with
thi estimation, for a trespass offering, unto the priest: and the
priest shall make an aton for him concern hi ignorance
wherein he er and wist it not, and it shall be forgiven him.

5:19 It is a trespass offering: he hath certainli trespass against
th lord.

6:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:2 If a soul sin, and
commit a trespass against the lord, and lie unto hi neighbour in that
which wa deliv him to keep, or in fellowship, or in a thing taken
away by violence, or hath deceiv hi neighbour; 6:3 Or have found
that which wa lost, and lieth concern it, and sweareth falsely; in
ani of all these that a man doeth, sin therein: 6:4 then it shall
be, becaus he hath sinned, and is guilty, that he shall restor that
which he took violent away, or the thing which he hath deceitfully
gotten, or that which wa deliv him to keep, or the lost thing
which he found, 6:5 Or all that about which he hath sworn falsely; he
shal even restor it in the principal, and shall add the fifth part
mor thereto, and give it unto him to whom it appertaineth, in the day
of hi trespass offering.

6:6 and he shall bring hi trespass offer unto the lord, a ram
without blemish out of the flock, with thi estimation, for a trespass
offering, unto the priest: 6:7 and the priest shall make an atonement
for him befor the lord: and it shall be forgiven him for ani thing of
al that he hath done in trespass therein.

6:8 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:9 command aaron and his
sons, saying, thi is the law of the burnt offering: It is the burnt
offering, becaus of the burn upon the altar all night unto the
morning, and the fire of the altar shall be burn in it.

6:10 and the priest shall put on hi linen garment, and hi linen
breech shall he put upon hi flesh, and take up the ash which the
fir hath consum with the burnt offer on the altar, and he shall
put them besid the altar.

6:11 and he shall put off hi garments, and put on other garments, and
carri forth the ash without the camp unto a clean place.

6:12 and the fire upon the altar shall be burn in it; it shall not
b put out: and the priest shall burn wood on it everi morning, and
lay the burnt offer in order upon it; and he shall burn thereon the
fat of the peac offerings.

6:13 the fire shall ever be burn upon the altar; it shall never go
out.

6:14 and thi is the law of the meat offering: the son of aaron shall
off it befor the lord, befor the altar.

6:15 and he shall take of it hi handful, of the flour of the meat
offering, and of the oil thereof, and all the frankincens which is
upon the meat offering, and shall burn it upon the altar for a sweet
savour, even the memori of it, unto the lord.

6:16 and the remaind thereof shall aaron and hi son eat: with
unleaven bread shall it be eaten in the holi place; in the court of
th tabernacl of the congreg they shall eat it.

6:17 It shall not be baken with leaven. I have given it unto them for
their portion of my offer made by fire; it is most holy, as is the
sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

6:18 all the male among the children of aaron shall eat of it. it
shal be a statut for ever in your gener concern the
off of the lord made by fire: everi one that toucheth them shall
b holy.

6:19 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:20 thi is the offering
of aaron and of hi sons, which they shall offer unto the lord in the
day when he is anointed; the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for
a meat offer perpetual, half of it in the morning, and half thereof
at night.

6:21 In a pan it shall be made with oil; and when it is baken, thou
shalt bring it in: and the baken piec of the meat offer shalt
thou offer for a sweet savour unto the lord.

6:22 and the priest of hi son that is anoint in hi stead shall
off it: it is a statut for ever unto the lord; it shall be wholly
burnt.

6:23 for everi meat offer for the priest shall be wholli burnt: it
shal not be eaten.

6:24 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:25 speak unto aaron and
to hi sons, saying, thi is the law of the sin offering: In the place
wher the burnt offer is kill shall the sin offer be killed
befor the lord: it is most holy.

6:26 the priest that offereth it for sin shall eat it: in the holy
plac shall it be eaten, in the court of the tabernacl of the
congregation.

6:27 whatsoev shall touch the flesh thereof shall be holy: and when
ther is sprinkl of the blood thereof upon ani garment, thou shalt
wash that whereon it wa sprinkl in the holi place.

6:28 but the earthen vessel wherein it is sodden shall be broken: and
if it be sodden in a brasen pot, it shall be both scoured, and rinsed
in water.

6:29 all the male among the priest shall eat thereof: it is most
holy.

6:30 and no sin offering, whereof ani of the blood is brought into the
tabernacl of the congreg to reconcil withal in the holi place,
shal be eaten: it shall be burnt in the fire.

7:1 likewis thi is the law of the trespass offering: it is most
holy.

7:2 In the place where they kill the burnt offer shall they kill
th trespass offering: and the blood thereof shall he sprinkl round
about upon the altar.

7:3 and he shall offer of it all the fat thereof; the rump, and the
fat that covereth the inwards, 7:4 and the two kidneys, and the fat
that is on them, which is by the flanks, and the caul that is above
th liver, with the kidneys, it shall he take away: 7:5 and the priest
shal burn them upon the altar for an offer made by fire unto the
lord: it is a trespass offering.

7:6 everi male among the priest shall eat thereof: it shall be eaten
in the holi place: it is most holy.

7:7 As the sin offer is, so is the trespass offering: there is one
law for them: the priest that maketh aton therewith shall have
it.

7:8 and the priest that offereth ani man' burnt offering, even the
priest shall have to himself the skin of the burnt offer which he
hath offered.

7:9 and all the meat offer that is baken in the oven, and all that
i dress in the fryingpan, and in the pan, shall be the priest's
that offereth it.

7:10 and everi meat offering, mingl with oil, and dry, shall all the
son of aaron have, one as much as another.

7:11 and thi is the law of the sacrific of peac offerings, which he
shal offer unto the lord.

7:12 If he offer it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the
sacrific of thanksgiv unleaven cake mingl with oil, and
unleaven wafer anoint with oil, and cake mingl with oil, of
fin flour, fried.

7:13 besid the cakes, he shall offer for hi offer leaven bread
with the sacrific of thanksgiv of hi peac offerings.

7:14 and of it he shall offer one out of the whole oblat for an
heav offer unto the lord, and it shall be the priest' that
sprinkleth the blood of the peac offerings.

7:15 and the flesh of the sacrific of hi peac offer for
thanksgiv shall be eaten the same day that it is offered; he shall
not leav ani of it until the morning.

7:16 but if the sacrific of hi offer be a vow, or a voluntary
offering, it shall be eaten the same day that he offereth his
sacrifice: and on the morrow also the remaind of it shall be eaten:
7:17 but the remaind of the flesh of the sacrific on the third day
shal be burnt with fire.

7:18 and if ani of the flesh of the sacrific of hi peac offerings
b eaten at all on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither
shal it be imput unto him that offereth it: it shall be an
abomination, and the soul that eateth of it shall bear hi iniquity.

7:19 and the flesh that toucheth ani unclean thing shall not be eaten;
it shall be burnt with fire: and as for the flesh, all that be clean
shal eat thereof.

7:20 but the soul that eateth of the flesh of the sacrific of peace
offerings, that pertain unto the lord, have hi unclean upon
him, even that soul shall be cut off from hi people.

7:21 moreov the soul that shall touch ani unclean thing, as the
unclean of man, or ani unclean beast, or ani abomin unclean
thing, and eat of the flesh of the sacrific of peac offerings, which
pertain unto the lord, even that soul shall be cut off from his
people.

7:22 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 7:23 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, Ye shall eat no manner of fat, of ox, or
of sheep, or of goat.

7:24 and the fat of the beast that dieth of itself, and the fat of
that which is torn with beasts, may be use in ani other use: but ye
shal in no wise eat of it.

7:25 for whosoev eateth the fat of the beast, of which men offer an
off made by fire unto the lord, even the soul that eateth it
shal be cut off from hi people.

7:26 moreov ye shall eat no manner of blood, whether it be of fowl
or of beast, in ani of your dwellings.

7:27 whatsoev soul it be that eateth ani manner of blood, even that
soul shall be cut off from hi people.

7:28 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 7:29 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, He that offereth the sacrific of his
peac offer unto the lord shall bring hi oblat unto the lord
of the sacrific of hi peac offerings.

7:30 hi own hand shall bring the offer of the lord made by fire,
th fat with the breast, it shall he bring, that the breast may be
wav for a wave offer befor the lord.

7:31 and the priest shall burn the fat upon the altar: but the breast
shal be aaron' and hi sons'.

7:32 and the right shoulder shall ye give unto the priest for an heave
off of the sacrific of your peac offerings.

7:33 He among the son of aaron, that offereth the blood of the peace
offerings, and the fat, shall have the right shoulder for hi part.

7:34 for the wave breast and the heav shoulder have I taken of the
children of israel from off the sacrific of their peac offerings,
and have given them unto aaron the priest and unto hi son by a
statut for ever from among the children of israel.

7:35 thi is the portion of the anoint of aaron, and of the
anoint of hi sons, out of the offer of the lord made by fire,
in the day when he present them to minist unto the lord in the
priest' office; 7:36 which the lord command to be given them of the
children of israel, in the day that he anoint them, by a statut for
ev throughout their generations.

7:37 thi is the law of the burnt offering, of the meat offering, and
of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the
consecrations, and of the sacrific of the peac offerings; 7:38 which
th lord command mose in mount sinai, in the day that he commanded
th children of israel to offer their oblat unto the lord, in the
wild of sinai.

8:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 8:2 take aaron and hi sons
with him, and the garments, and the anoint oil, and a bullock for
