th sin offering, and two rams, and a basket of unleaven bread; 8:3
and gather thou all the congreg togeth unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation.

8:4 and mose did as the lord command him; and the assembl was
gath togeth unto the door of the tabernacl of the congregation.

8:5 and mose said unto the congregation, thi is the thing which the
lord command to be done.

8:6 and mose brought aaron and hi sons, and wash them with water.

8:7 and he put upon him the coat, and gird him with the girdle, and
cloth him with the robe, and put the ephod upon him, and he girded
him with the curiou girdl of the ephod, and bound it unto him
therewith.

8:8 and he put the breastplat upon him: also he put in the
breastpl the urim and the thummim.

8:9 and he put the mitr upon hi head; also upon the mitre, even upon
hi forefront, did he put the golden plate, the holi crown; as the
lord command moses.

8:10 and mose took the anoint oil, and anoint the tabernacl and
al that wa therein, and sanctifi them.

8:11 and he sprinkl thereof upon the altar seven times, and anointed
th altar and all hi vessels, both the laver and hi foot, to
sanctifi them.

8:12 and he pour of the anoint oil upon aaron' head, and
anoint him, to sanctifi him.

8:13 and mose brought aaron' sons, and put coat upon them, and
gird them with girdles, and put bonnet upon them; as the lord
command moses.

8:14 and he brought the bullock for the sin offering: and aaron and
hi son laid their hand upon the head of the bullock for the sin
offering.

8:15 and he slew it; and mose took the blood, and put it upon the
horn of the altar round about with hi finger, and purifi the
altar, and pour the blood at the bottom of the altar, and sanctified
it, to make reconcili upon it.

8:16 and he took all the fat that wa upon the inwards, and the caul
abov the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and mose burned
it upon the altar.

8:17 but the bullock, and hi hide, hi flesh, and hi dung, he burnt
with fire without the camp; as the lord command moses.

8:18 and he brought the ram for the burnt offering: and aaron and his
son laid their hand upon the head of the ram.

8:19 and he kill it; and mose sprinkl the blood upon the altar
round about.

8:20 and he cut the ram into pieces; and mose burnt the head, and the
pieces, and the fat.

8:21 and he wash the inward and the leg in water; and mose burnt
th whole ram upon the altar: it wa a burnt sacrific for a sweet
savour, and an offer made by fire unto the lord; as the lord
command moses.

8:22 and he brought the other ram, the ram of consecration: and aaron
and hi son laid their hand upon the head of the ram.

8:23 and he slew it; and mose took of the blood of it, and put it
upon the tip of aaron' right ear, and upon the thumb of hi right
hand, and upon the great toe of hi right foot.

8:24 and he brought aaron' sons, and mose put of the blood upon the
tip of their right ear, and upon the thumb of their right hands, and
upon the great toe of their right feet: and mose sprinkl the blood
upon the altar round about.

8:25 and he took the fat, and the rump, and all the fat that wa upon
th inwards, and the caul abov the liver, and the two kidneys, and
their fat, and the right shoulder: 8:26 and out of the basket of
unleaven bread, that wa befor the lord, he took one unleavened
cake, and a cake of oil bread, and one wafer, and put them on the
fat, and upon the right shoulder: 8:27 and he put all upon aaron's
hands, and upon hi sons' hands, and wave them for a wave offering
befor the lord.

8:28 and mose took them from off their hands, and burnt them on the
altar upon the burnt offering: they were consecr for a sweet
savour: it is an offer made by fire unto the lord.

8:29 and mose took the breast, and wave it for a wave offering
befor the lord: for of the ram of consecr it wa moses' part; as
th lord command moses.

8:30 and mose took of the anoint oil, and of the blood which was
upon the altar, and sprinkl it upon aaron, and upon hi garments,
and upon hi sons, and upon hi sons' garment with him; and
sanctifi aaron, and hi garments, and hi sons, and hi sons'
gar with him.

8:31 and mose said unto aaron and to hi sons, boil the flesh at the
door of the tabernacl of the congregation: and there eat it with the
bread that is in the basket of consecrations, as I commanded, saying,
aaron and hi son shall eat it.

8:32 and that which remaineth of the flesh and of the bread shall ye
burn with fire.

8:33 and ye shall not go out of the door of the tabernacl of the
congreg in seven days, until the day of your consecr be at
an end: for seven day shall he consecr you.

8:34 As he hath done thi day, so the lord hath command to do, to
mak an aton for you.

8:35 therefor shall ye abid at the door of the tabernacl of the
congreg day and night seven days, and keep the charg of the
lord, that ye die not: for so I am commanded.

8:36 So aaron and hi son did all thing which the lord command by
th hand of moses.

9:1 and it came to pass on the eighth day, that mose call aaron and
hi sons, and the elder of israel; 9:2 and he said unto aaron, take
the a young calf for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering,
without blemish, and offer them befor the lord.

9:3 and unto the children of israel thou shalt speak, saying, take ye
a kid of the goat for a sin offering; and a calf and a lamb, both of
th first year, without blemish, for a burnt offering; 9:4 also a
bullock and a ram for peac offerings, to sacrific befor the lord;
and a meat offer mingl with oil: for to day the lord will appear
unto you.

9:5 and they brought that which mose command befor the tabernacle
of the congregation: and all the congreg drew near and stood
befor the lord.

9:6 and mose said, thi is the thing which the lord command that ye
should do: and the glori of the lord shall appear unto you.

9:7 and mose said unto aaron, Go unto the altar, and offer thi sin
offering, and thi burnt offering, and make an aton for thyself,
and for the people: and offer the offer of the people, and make an
aton for them; as the lord commanded.

9:8 aaron therefor went unto the altar, and slew the calf of the sin
offering, which wa for himself.

9:9 and the son of aaron brought the blood unto him: and he dipped
hi finger in the blood, and put it upon the horn of the altar, and
pour out the blood at the bottom of the altar: 9:10 but the fat, and
th kidneys, and the caul abov the liver of the sin offering, he
burnt upon the altar; as the lord command moses.

9:11 and the flesh and the hide he burnt with fire without the camp.

9:12 and he slew the burnt offering; and aaron' son present unto
him the blood, which he sprinkl round about upon the altar.

9:13 and they present the burnt offer unto him, with the pieces
thereof, and the head: and he burnt them upon the altar.

9:14 and he did wash the inward and the legs, and burnt them upon the
burnt offer on the altar.

9:15 and he brought the people' offering, and took the goat, which
wa the sin offer for the people, and slew it, and offer it for
sin, as the first.

9:16 and he brought the burnt offering, and offer it accord to
th manner.

9:17 and he brought the meat offering, and took an hand thereof,
and burnt it upon the altar, besid the burnt sacrific of the
morning.

9:18 He slew also the bullock and the ram for a sacrific of peace
offerings, which wa for the people: and aaron' son present unto
him the blood, which he sprinkl upon the altar round about, 9:19 and
th fat of the bullock and of the ram, the rump, and that which
covereth the inwards, and the kidneys, and the caul abov the liver:
9:20 and they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burnt the fat upon
th altar: 9:21 and the breast and the right shoulder aaron wave for
a wave offer befor the lord; as mose commanded.

9:22 and aaron lift up hi hand toward the people, and bless them,
and came down from offer of the sin offering, and the burnt
offering, and peac offerings.

9:23 and mose and aaron went into the tabernacl of the congregation,
and came out, and bless the people: and the glori of the lord
appear unto all the people.

9:24 and there came a fire out from befor the lord, and consum upon
th altar the burnt offer and the fat: which when all the people
saw, they shouted, and fell on their faces.

10:1 and nadab and abihu, the son of aaron, took either of them his
censer, and put fire therein, and put incens thereon, and offered
strang fire befor the lord, which he command them not.

10:2 and there went out fire from the lord, and devour them, and
they die befor the lord.

10:3 then mose said unto aaron, thi is it that the lord spake,
saying, I will be sanctifi in them that come nigh me, and befor all
th peopl I will be glorified. and aaron held hi peace.

10:4 and mose call mishael and elzaphan, the son of uzziel the
uncl of aaron, and said unto them, come near, carri your brethren
from befor the sanctuari out of the camp.

10:5 So they went near, and carri them in their coat out of the
camp; as mose had said.

10:6 and mose said unto aaron, and unto eleazar and unto ithamar, his
sons, uncov not your heads, neither rend your clothes; lest ye die,
and lest wrath come upon all the people: but let your brethren, the
whol hous of israel, bewail the burn which the lord hath kindled.

10:7 and ye shall not go out from the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation, lest ye die: for the anoint oil of the lord is upon
you. and they did accord to the word of moses.

10:8 and the lord spake unto aaron, saying, 10:9 Do not drink wine nor
strong drink, thou, nor thi son with thee, when ye go into the
tabernacl of the congregation, lest ye die: it shall be a statut for
ev throughout your generations: 10:10 and that ye may put difference
between holi and unholy, and between unclean and clean; 10:11 and that
y may teach the children of israel all the statut which the lord
hath spoken unto them by the hand of moses.

10:12 and mose spake unto aaron, and unto eleazar and unto ithamar,
hi son that were left, take the meat offer that remaineth of the
off of the lord made by fire, and eat it without leaven beside
th altar: for it is most holy: 10:13 and ye shall eat it in the holy
place, becaus it is thi due, and thi sons' due, of the sacrific of
th lord made by fire: for so I am commanded.

10:14 and the wave breast and heav shoulder shall ye eat in a clean
place; thou, and thi sons, and thi daughter with thee: for they be
thi due, and thi sons' due, which are given out of the sacrific of
peac offer of the children of israel.

10:15 the heav shoulder and the wave breast shall they bring with the
off made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering
befor the lord; and it shall be thine, and thi sons' with thee, by a
statut for ever; as the lord hath commanded.

10:16 and mose dilig sought the goat of the sin offering, and,
behold, it wa burnt: and he wa angri with eleazar and ithamar, the
son of aaron which were left alive, saying, 10:17 wherefor have ye
not eaten the sin offer in the holi place, see it is most holy,
and god hath given it you to bear the iniqu of the congregation, to
mak aton for them befor the lord?  10:18 behold, the blood of
it wa not brought in within the holi place: ye should inde have
eaten it in the holi place, as I commanded.

10:19 and aaron said unto moses, behold, thi day have they offered
their sin offer and their burnt offer befor the lord; and such
th have befallen me: and if I had eaten the sin offer to day,
should it have been accept in the sight of the lord?  10:20 and when
mos heard that, he wa content.

11:1 and the lord spake unto mose and to aaron, say unto them,
11:2 speak unto the children of israel, saying, these are the beasts
which ye shall eat among all the beast that are on the earth.

11:3 whatsoev parteth the hoof, and is clovenfooted, and cheweth the
cud, among the beasts, that shall ye eat.

11:4 nevertheless these shall ye not eat of them that chew the cud, or
of them that divid the hoof: as the camel, becaus he cheweth the
cud, but divideth not the hoof; he is unclean unto you.

11:5 and the coney, becaus he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the
hoof; he is unclean unto you.

11:6 and the hare, becaus he cheweth the cud, but divideth not the
hoof; he is unclean unto you.

11:7 and the swine, though he divid the hoof, and be clovenfooted,
yet he cheweth not the cud; he is unclean to you.

11:8 Of their flesh shall ye not eat, and their carcas shall ye not
touch; they are unclean to you.

11:9 these shall ye eat of all that are in the waters: whatsoev hath
fin and scale in the waters, in the seas, and in the rivers, them
shal ye eat.

11:10 and all that have not fin and scale in the seas, and in the
rivers, of all that move in the waters, and of ani live thing which
i in the waters, they shall be an abomin unto you: 11:11 they
shal be even an abomin unto you; ye shall not eat of their
flesh, but ye shall have their carcas in abomination.

11:12 whatsoev hath no fin nor scale in the waters, that shall be
an abomin unto you.

11:13 and these are they which ye shall have in abomin among the
fowls; they shall not be eaten, they are an abomination: the eagle,
and the ossifrage, and the ospray, 11:14 and the vulture, and the kite
aft hi kind; 11:15 everi raven after hi kind; 11:16 and the owl,
and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after hi kind, 11:17
and the littl owl, and the cormorant, and the great owl, 11:18 and
th swan, and the pelican, and the gier eagle, 11:19 and the stork,
th heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.

11:20 all fowl that creep, go upon all four, shall be an
abomin unto you.

11:21 yet these may ye eat of everi fli creep thing that goeth
upon all four, which have leg abov their feet, to leap withal upon
th earth; 11:22 even these of them ye may eat; the locust after his
kind, and the bald locust after hi kind, and the beetl after his
kind, and the grasshopp after hi kind.

11:23 but all other fli creep things, which have four feet,
shal be an abomin unto you.

11:24 and for these ye shall be unclean: whosoev toucheth the
carcas of them shall be unclean until the even.

11:25 and whosoev beareth ought of the carcas of them shall wash
hi clothes, and be unclean until the even.

11:26 the carcas of everi beast which divideth the hoof, and is not
clovenfooted, nor cheweth the cud, are unclean unto you: everi one
that toucheth them shall be unclean.

11:27 and whatsoev goeth upon hi paws, among all manner of beasts
that go on all four, those are unclean unto you: whoso toucheth their
carcas shall be unclean until the even.

11:28 and he that beareth the carcas of them shall wash hi clothes,
and be unclean until the even: they are unclean unto you.

11:29 these also shall be unclean unto you among the creep things
that creep upon the earth; the weasel, and the mouse, and the tortoise
aft hi kind, 11:30 and the ferret, and the chameleon, and the
lizard, and the snail, and the mole.

11:31 these are unclean to you among all that creep: whosoev doth
touch them, when they be dead, shall be unclean until the even.

11:32 and upon whatsoev ani of them, when they are dead, doth fall,
it shall be unclean; whether it be ani vessel of wood, or raiment, or
skin, or sack, whatsoev vessel it be, wherein ani work is done, it
must be put into water, and it shall be unclean until the even; so it
shal be cleansed.

11:33 and everi earthen vessel, whereinto ani of them falleth,
whatsoev is in it shall be unclean; and ye shall break it.

11:34 Of all meat which may be eaten, that on which such water cometh
shal be unclean: and all drink that may be drunk in everi such vessel
shal be unclean.

11:35 and everi thing whereupon ani part of their carcas falleth
shal be unclean; whether it be oven, or rang for pots, they shall
b broken down: for they are unclean and shall be unclean unto you.

11:36 nevertheless a fountain or pit, wherein there is plenti of
water, shall be clean: but that which toucheth their carcas shall be
unclean.

11:37 and if ani part of their carcas fall upon ani sow seed which
i to be sown, it shall be clean.

11:38 but if ani water be put upon the seed, and ani part of their
carcas fall thereon, it shall be unclean unto you.

11:39 and if ani beast, of which ye may eat, die; he that toucheth the
carcas thereof shall be unclean until the even.

11:40 and he that eateth of the carcas of it shall wash hi clothes,
and be unclean until the even: he also that beareth the carcas of it
shal wash hi clothes, and be unclean until the even.

11:41 and everi creep thing that creepeth upon the earth shall be
an abomination; it shall not be eaten.

11:42 whatsoev goeth upon the belly, and whatsoev goeth upon all
four, or whatsoev hath more feet among all creep thing that
creep upon the earth, them ye shall not eat; for they are an
abomination.

11:43 Ye shall not make yourselv abomin with ani creep thing
that creepeth, neither shall ye make yourselv unclean with them,
that ye should be defil thereby.

11:44 for I am the lord your god: ye shall therefor sanctify
yourselves, and ye shall be holy; for I am holy: neither shall ye
defil yourselv with ani manner of creep thing that creepeth upon
th earth.

11:45 for I am the lord that bringeth you up out of the land of egypt,
to be your god: ye shall therefor be holy, for I am holy.

11:46 thi is the law of the beasts, and of the fowl, and of every
liv creatur that moveth in the waters, and of everi creatur that
creepeth upon the earth: 11:47 To make a differ between the
unclean and the clean, and between the beast that may be eaten and the
beast that may not be eaten.

12:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 12:2 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, If a woman have conceiv seed, and born a
man child: then she shall be unclean seven days; accord to the days
of the separ for her infirm shall she be unclean.

12:3 and in the eighth day the flesh of hi foreskin shall be
circumcised.

12:4 and she shall then continu in the blood of her purifi three
and thirti days; she shall touch no hallow thing, nor come into the
sanctuary, until the day of her purifi be fulfilled.

12:5 but if she bear a maid child, then she shall be unclean two
weeks, as in her separation: and she shall continu in the blood of
her purifi threescor and six days.

12:6 and when the day of her purifi are fulfilled, for a son, or
for a daughter, she shall bring a lamb of the first year for a burnt
offering, and a young pigeon, or a turtledove, for a sin offering,
unto the door of the tabernacl of the congregation, unto the priest:
12:7 who shall offer it befor the lord, and make an aton for
her; and she shall be cleans from the issu of her blood. thi is
th law for her that hath born a male or a female.

12:8 and if she be not abl to bring a lamb, then she shall bring two
turtles, or two young pigeons; the one for the burnt offering, and the
oth for a sin offering: and the priest shall make an aton for
her, and she shall be clean.

13:1 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron, saying, 13:2 when a man
shal have in the skin of hi flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot,
and it be in the skin of hi flesh like the plagu of leprosy; then he
shal be brought unto aaron the priest, or unto one of hi son the
priests: 13:3 and the priest shall look on the plagu in the skin of
th flesh: and when the hair in the plagu is turn white, and the
plagu in sight be deeper than the skin of hi flesh, it is a plague
of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounc him
unclean.

13:4 If the bright spot be white in the skin of hi flesh, and in
sight be not deeper than the skin, and the hair thereof be not turned
white; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plagu seven
days: 13:5 and the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and,
behold, if the plagu in hi sight be at a stay, and the plagu spread
not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven day more:
13:6 and the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and,
behold, if the plagu be somewhat dark, and the plagu spread not in
th skin, the priest shall pronounc him clean: it is but a scab: and
h shall wash hi clothes, and be clean.

13:7 but if the scab spread much abroad in the skin, after that he
hath been seen of the priest for hi cleansing, he shall be seen of
th priest again.

13:8 and if the priest see that, behold, the scab spreadeth in the
skin, then the priest shall pronounc him unclean: it is a leprosy.

13:9 when the plagu of leprosi is in a man, then he shall be brought
unto the priest; 13:10 and the priest shall see him: and, behold, if
th rise be white in the skin, and it have turn the hair white,
and there be quick raw flesh in the rising; 13:11 It is an old leprosy
in the skin of hi flesh, and the priest shall pronounc him unclean,
and shall not shut him up: for he is unclean.

13:12 and if a leprosi break out abroad in the skin, and the leprosy
cov all the skin of him that hath the plagu from hi head even to
hi foot, wheresoev the priest looketh; 13:13 then the priest shall
consider: and, behold, if the leprosi have cover all hi flesh, he
shal pronounc him clean that hath the plague: it is all turned
white: he is clean.

13:14 but when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.

13:15 and the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounc him to be
unclean: for the raw flesh is unclean: it is a leprosy.

13:16 Or if the raw flesh turn again, and be chang unto white, he
shal come unto the priest; 13:17 and the priest shall see him: and,
behold, if the plagu be turn into white; then the priest shall
pronounc him clean that hath the plague: he is clean.

13:18 the flesh also, in which, even in the skin thereof, wa a boil,
and is healed, 13:19 and in the place of the boil there be a white
rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be
shew to the priest; 13:20 and if, when the priest seeth it, behold,
it be in sight lower than the skin, and the hair thereof be turned
white; the priest shall pronounc him unclean: it is a plagu of
leprosi broken out of the boil.

13:21 but if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white
hair therein, and if it be not lower than the skin, but be somewhat
dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days: 13:22 and if it
spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounc him
unclean: it is a plague.

13:23 but if the bright spot stay in hi place, and spread not, it is
a burn boil; and the priest shall pronounc him clean.

13:24 Or if there be ani flesh, in the skin whereof there is a hot
burning, and the quick flesh that burneth have a white bright spot,
somewhat reddish, or white; 13:25 then the priest shall look upon it:
and, behold, if the hair in the bright spot be turn white, and it be
in sight deeper than the skin; it is a leprosi broken out of the
burning: wherefor the priest shall pronounc him unclean: it is the
plagu of leprosy.

13:26 but if the priest look on it, and, behold, there be no white
hair in the bright spot, and it be no lower than the other skin, but
b somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days: 13:27
and the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: and if it be
spread much abroad in the skin, then the priest shall pronounc him
unclean: it is the plagu of leprosy.

13:28 and if the bright spot stay in hi place, and spread not in the
skin, but it be somewhat dark; it is a rise of the burning, and the
priest shall pronounc him clean: for it is an inflamm of the
burning.

13:29 If a man or woman have a plagu upon the head or the beard;
13:30 then the priest shall see the plague: and, behold, if it be in
sight deeper than the skin; and there be in it a yellow thin hair;
then the priest shall pronounc him unclean: it is a dri scall, even a
leprosi upon the head or beard.

13:31 and if the priest look on the plagu of the scall, and, behold,
it be not in sight deeper than the skin, and that there is no black
hair in it; then the priest shall shut up him that hath the plagu of
th scall seven days: 13:32 and in the seventh day the priest shall
look on the plague: and, behold, if the scall spread not, and there be
in it no yellow hair, and the scall be not in sight deeper than the
skin; 13:33 He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and
th priest shall shut up him that hath the scall seven day more:
13:34 and in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and,
behold, if the scall be not spread in the skin, nor be in sight deeper
than the skin; then the priest shall pronounc him clean: and he shall
wash hi clothes, and be clean.

13:35 but if the scall spread much in the skin after hi cleansing;
13:36 then the priest shall look on him: and, behold, if the scall be
spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he is
unclean.

13:37 but if the scall be in hi sight at a stay, and that there is
black hair grown up therein; the scall is healed, he is clean: and the
priest shall pronounc him clean.

13:38 If a man also or a woman have in the skin of their flesh bright
spots, even white bright spots; 13:39 then the priest shall look: and,
behold, if the bright spot in the skin of their flesh be darkish
white; it is a freckl spot that groweth in the skin; he is clean.

13:40 and the man whose hair is fallen off hi head, he is bald; yet
i he clean.

13:41 and he that hath hi hair fallen off from the part of hi head
toward hi face, he is forehead bald: yet is he clean.

13:42 and if there be in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white
reddish sore; it is a leprosi sprung up in hi bald head, or hi bald
forehead.

13:43 then the priest shall look upon it: and, behold, if the rising
of the sore be white reddish in hi bald head, or in hi bald
forehead, as the leprosi appeareth in the skin of the flesh; 13:44 he
i a leprou man, he is unclean: the priest shall pronounc him
utterli unclean; hi plagu is in hi head.

13:45 and the leper in whom the plagu is, hi cloth shall be rent,
and hi head bare, and he shall put a cover upon hi upper lip, and
shal cry, unclean, unclean.

13:46 all the day wherein the plagu shall be in him he shall be
defiled; he is unclean: he shall dwell alone; without the camp shall
hi habit be.

13:47 the garment also that the plagu of leprosi is in, whether it be
a woollen garment, or a linen garment; 13:48 whether it be in the
warp, or woof; of linen, or of woollen; whether in a skin, or in any
th made of skin; 13:49 and if the plagu be greenish or reddish in
th garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in
ani thing of skin; it is a plagu of leprosy, and shall be shew unto
th priest: 13:50 and the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut
up it that hath the plagu seven days: 13:51 and he shall look on the
plagu on the seventh day: if the plagu be spread in the garment,
eith in the warp, or in the woof, or in a skin, or in ani work that
i made of skin; the plagu is a fret leprosy; it is unclean.

13:52 He shall therefor burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in
woollen or in linen, or ani thing of skin, wherein the plagu is: for
it is a fret leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.

13:53 and if the priest shall look, and, behold, the plagu be not
spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any
th of skin; 13:54 then the priest shall command that they wash the
th wherein the plagu is, and he shall shut it up seven day more:
13:55 and the priest shall look on the plague, after that it is
washed: and, behold, if the plagu have not chang hi colour, and
th plagu be not spread; it is unclean; thou shalt burn it in the
fire; it is fret inward, whether it be bare within or without.

13:56 and if the priest look, and, behold, the plagu be somewhat dark
aft the wash of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or
out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof: 13:57 and if
it appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or
in ani thing of skin; it is a spread plague: thou shalt burn that
wherein the plagu is with fire.

13:58 and the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatsoev thing of
skin it be, which thou shalt wash, if the plagu be depart from
them, then it shall be wash the second time, and shall be clean.

13:59 thi is the law of the plagu of leprosi in a garment of woollen
or linen, either in the warp, or woof, or ani thing of skins, to
pronounc it clean, or to pronounc it unclean.

14:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 14:2 thi shall be the law
of the leper in the day of hi cleansing: He shall be brought unto the
priest: 14:3 and the priest shall go forth out of the camp; and the
priest shall look, and, behold, if the plagu of leprosi be heal in
th leper; 14:4 then shall the priest command to take for him that is
to be cleans two bird aliv and clean, and cedar wood, and scarlet,
and hyssop: 14:5 and the priest shall command that one of the bird be
kil in an earthen vessel over run water: 14:6 As for the living
bird, he shall take it, and the cedar wood, and the scarlet, and the
hyssop, and shall dip them and the live bird in the blood of the
bird that wa kill over the run water: 14:7 and he shall
sprinkl upon him that is to be cleans from the leprosi seven times,
and shall pronounc him clean, and shall let the live bird loose
into the open field.

14:8 and he that is to be cleans shall wash hi clothes, and shave
off all hi hair, and wash himself in water, that he may be clean: and
aft that he shall come into the camp, and shall tarri abroad out of
hi tent seven days.

14:9 but it shall be on the seventh day, that he shall shave all his
hair off hi head and hi beard and hi eyebrows, even all hi hair he
shal shave off: and he shall wash hi clothes, also he shall wash his
flesh in water, and he shall be clean.

14:10 and on the eighth day he shall take two he lamb without
blemish, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish, and three
tenth deal of fine flour for a meat offering, mingl with oil, and
on log of oil.

14:11 and the priest that maketh him clean shall present the man that
i to be made clean, and those things, befor the lord, at the door of
th tabernacl of the congregation: 14:12 and the priest shall take
on he lamb, and offer him for a trespass offering, and the log of
oil, and wave them for a wave offer befor the lord: 14:13 and he
shal slay the lamb in the place where he shall kill the sin offering
and the burnt offering, in the holi place: for as the sin offer is
th priest's, so is the trespass offering: it is most holy: 14:14 and
th priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass offering, and
th priest shall put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is
to be cleansed, and upon the thumb of hi right hand, and upon the
great toe of hi right foot: 14:15 and the priest shall take some of
th log of oil, and pour it into the palm of hi own left hand: 14:16
and the priest shall dip hi right finger in the oil that is in his
left hand, and shall sprinkl of the oil with hi finger seven times
befor the lord: 14:17 and of the rest of the oil that is in hi hand
shal the priest put upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to
b cleansed, and upon the thumb of hi right hand, and upon the great
to of hi right foot, upon the blood of the trespass offering: 14:18
and the remnant of the oil that is in the priest' hand he shall pour
upon the head of him that is to be cleansed: and the priest shall make
an aton for him befor the lord.

14:19 and the priest shall offer the sin offering, and make an
aton for him that is to be cleans from hi uncleanness; and
afterward he shall kill the burnt offering: 14:20 and the priest shall
off the burnt offer and the meat offer upon the altar: and the
priest shall make an aton for him, and he shall be clean.

14:21 and if he be poor, and cannot get so much; then he shall take
on lamb for a trespass offer to be waved, to make an aton for
him, and one tenth deal of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat
offering, and a log of oil; 14:22 and two turtledoves, or two young
pigeons, such as he is abl to get; and the one shall be a sin
offering, and the other a burnt offering.

14:23 and he shall bring them on the eighth day for hi cleans unto
th priest, unto the door of the tabernacl of the congregation,
befor the lord.

14:24 and the priest shall take the lamb of the trespass offering, and
th log of oil, and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering
befor the lord: 14:25 and he shall kill the lamb of the trespass
offering, and the priest shall take some of the blood of the trespass
offering, and put it upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to
b cleansed, and upon the thumb of hi right hand, and upon the great
to of hi right foot: 14:26 and the priest shall pour of the oil into
th palm of hi own left hand: 14:27 and the priest shall sprinkle
with hi right finger some of the oil that is in hi left hand seven
tim befor the lord: 14:28 and the priest shall put of the oil that
i in hi hand upon the tip of the right ear of him that is to be
cleansed, and upon the thumb of hi right hand, and upon the great toe
of hi right foot, upon the place of the blood of the trespass
offering: 14:29 and the rest of the oil that is in the priest' hand
h shall put upon the head of him that is to be cleansed, to make an
aton for him befor the lord.

14:30 and he shall offer the one of the turtledoves, or of the young
pigeons, such as he can get; 14:31 even such as he is abl to get, the
on for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, with the
meat offering: and the priest shall make an aton for him that is
to be cleans befor the lord.

14:32 thi is the law of him in whom is the plagu of leprosy, whose
hand is not abl to get that which pertaineth to hi cleansing.

14:33 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 14:34 when
y be come into the land of canaan, which I give to you for a
possession, and I put the plagu of leprosi in a hous of the land of
your possession; 14:35 and he that owneth the hous shall come and
tel the priest, saying, It seemeth to me there is as it were a plague
in the house: 14:36 then the priest shall command that they empti the
house, befor the priest go into it to see the plague, that all that
i in the hous be not made unclean: and afterward the priest shall go
in to see the house: 14:37 and he shall look on the plague, and,
behold, if the plagu be in the wall of the hous with hollow
strakes, greenish or reddish, which in sight are lower than the wall;
14:38 then the priest shall go out of the hous to the door of the
house, and shut up the hous seven days: 14:39 and the priest shall
com again the seventh day, and shall look: and, behold, if the plague
b spread in the wall of the house; 14:40 then the priest shall
command that they take away the stone in which the plagu is, and
they shall cast them into an unclean place without the city: 14:41 and
h shall caus the hous to be scrape within round about, and they
shal pour out the dust that they scrape off without the citi into an
unclean place: 14:42 and they shall take other stones, and put them in
th place of those stones; and he shall take other morter, and shall
plaist the house.

14:43 and if the plagu come again, and break out in the house, after
that he hath taken away the stones, and after he hath scrape the
house, and after it is plaistered; 14:44 then the priest shall come
and look, and, behold, if the plagu be spread in the house, it is a
fret leprosi in the house; it is unclean.

14:45 and he shall break down the house, the stone of it, and the
timb thereof, and all the morter of the house; and he shall carry
them forth out of the citi into an unclean place.

14:46 moreov he that goeth into the hous all the while that it is
shut up shall be unclean until the even.

14:47 and he that lieth in the hous shall wash hi clothes; and he
that eateth in the hous shall wash hi clothes.

14:48 and if the priest shall come in, and look upon it, and, behold,
th plagu hath not spread in the house, after the hous was
plaistered: then the priest shall pronounc the hous clean, because
th plagu is healed.

14:49 and he shall take to cleans the hous two birds, and cedar
wood, and scarlet, and hyssop: 14:50 and he shall kill the one of the
bird in an earthen vessel over run water: 14:51 and he shall take
th cedar wood, and the hyssop, and the scarlet, and the live bird,
and dip them in the blood of the slain bird, and in the run water,
and sprinkl the hous seven times: 14:52 and he shall cleans the
hous with the blood of the bird, and with the run water, and with
th live bird, and with the cedar wood, and with the hyssop, and
with the scarlet: 14:53 but he shall let go the live bird out of the
citi into the open fields, and make an aton for the house: and it
shal be clean.

14:54 thi is the law for all manner of plagu of leprosy, and scall,
14:55 and for the leprosi of a garment, and of a house, 14:56 and for
a rising, and for a scab, and for a bright spot: 14:57 To teach when
it is unclean, and when it is clean: thi is the law of leprosy.

15:1 and the lord spake unto mose and to aaron, saying, 15:2 speak
unto the children of israel, and say unto them, when ani man hath a
run issu out of hi flesh, becaus of hi issu he is unclean.

15:3 and thi shall be hi unclean in hi issue: whether hi flesh
run with hi issue, or hi flesh be stop from hi issue, it is his
uncleanness.

15:4 everi bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and
everi thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be unclean.

15:5 and whosoev toucheth hi bed shall wash hi clothes, and bathe
himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

15:6 and he that sitteth on ani thing whereon he sat that hath the
issu shall wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be
unclean until the even.

15:7 and he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issu shall
wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be unclean until the
even.

15:8 and if he that hath the issu spit upon him that is clean; then
h shall wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be unclean
until the even.

15:9 and what saddl soever he rideth upon that hath the issu shall
b unclean.

15:10 and whosoev toucheth ani thing that wa under him shall be
unclean until the even: and he that beareth ani of those thing shall
wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be unclean until the
even.

15:11 and whomsoev he toucheth that hath the issue, and hath not
rins hi hand in water, he shall wash hi clothes, and bathe
himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

15:12 and the vessel of earth, that he toucheth which hath the issue,
shal be broken: and everi vessel of wood shall be rins in water.

15:13 and when he that hath an issu is cleans of hi issue; then he
shal number to himself seven day for hi cleansing, and wash his
clothes, and bath hi flesh in run water, and shall be clean.

15:14 and on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtledoves, or
two young pigeons, and come befor the lord unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation, and give them unto the priest: 15:15
and the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin offering, and the
oth for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an aton for
him befor the lord for hi issue.

15:16 and if ani man' seed of copul go out from him, then he
shal wash all hi flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.

15:17 and everi garment, and everi skin, whereon is the seed of
copulation, shall be wash with water, and be unclean until the even.

15:18 the woman also with whom man shall lie with seed of copulation,
they shall both bath themselv in water, and be unclean until the
even.

15:19 and if a woman have an issue, and her issu in her flesh be
blood, she shall be put apart seven days: and whosoev toucheth her
shal be unclean until the even.

15:20 and everi thing that she lieth upon in her separ shall be
unclean: everi thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.

15:21 and whosoev toucheth her bed shall wash hi clothes, and bathe
himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

15:22 and whosoev toucheth ani thing that she sat upon shall wash
hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be unclean until the
even.

15:23 and if it be on her bed, or on ani thing whereon she sitteth,
when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.

15:24 and if ani man lie with her at all, and her flower be upon him,
h shall be unclean seven days; and all the bed whereon he lieth shall
b unclean.

15:25 and if a woman have an issu of her blood mani day out of the
tim of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her
separation; all the day of the issu of her unclean shall be as
th day of her separation: she shall be unclean.

15:26 everi bed whereon she lieth all the day of her issu shall be
unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoev she sitteth upon
shal be unclean, as the unclean of her separation.

15:27 and whosoev toucheth those thing shall be unclean, and shall
wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and be unclean until the
even.

15:28 but if she be cleans of her issue, then she shall number to
herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

15:29 and on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or
two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation.

15:30 and the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the
oth for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an aton for
her befor the lord for the issu of her uncleanness.

15:31 thu shall ye separ the children of israel from their
uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile
mi tabernacl that is among them.

15:32 thi is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him whose seed
goeth from him, and is defil therewith; 15:33 and of her that is
sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man, and of
th woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.

16:1 and the lord spake unto mose after the death of the two son of
aaron, when they offer befor the lord, and died; 16:2 and the lord
said unto moses, speak unto aaron thi brother, that he come not at all
tim into the holi place within the vail befor the merci seat, which
i upon the ark; that he die not: for I will appear in the cloud upon
th merci seat.

16:3 thu shall aaron come into the holi place: with a young bullock
for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

16:4 He shall put on the holi linen coat, and he shall have the linen
breech upon hi flesh, and shall be gird with a linen girdle, and
with the linen mitr shall he be attired: these are holi garments;
therefor shall he wash hi flesh in water, and so put them on.

16:5 and he shall take of the congreg of the children of israel
two kid of the goat for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt
offering.

16:6 and aaron shall offer hi bullock of the sin offering, which is
for himself, and make an aton for himself, and for hi house.

16:7 and he shall take the two goats, and present them befor the lord
at the door of the tabernacl of the congregation.

16:8 and aaron shall cast lot upon the two goats; one lot for the
lord, and the other lot for the scapegoat.

16:9 and aaron shall bring the goat upon which the lord' lot fell,
and offer him for a sin offering.

16:10 but the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall
b present aliv befor the lord, to make an aton with him, and
to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.

16:11 and aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin offering, which is
for himself, and shall make an aton for himself, and for his
house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin offer which is for
himself: 16:12 and he shall take a censer full of burn coal of
fir from off the altar befor the lord, and hi hand full of sweet
incens beaten small, and bring it within the vail: 16:13 and he shall
put the incens upon the fire befor the lord, that the cloud of the
incens may cover the merci seat that is upon the testimony, that he
di not: 16:14 and he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and
sprinkl it with hi finger upon the merci seat eastward; and before
th merci seat shall he sprinkl of the blood with hi finger seven
times.

16:15 then shall he kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the
people, and bring hi blood within the vail, and do with that blood as
h did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkl it upon the mercy
seat, and befor the merci seat: 16:16 and he shall make an atonement
for the holi place, becaus of the unclean of the children of
israel, and becaus of their transgress in all their sins: and so
shal he do for the tabernacl of the congregation, that remaineth
among them in the midst of their uncleanness.

16:17 and there shall be no man in the tabernacl of the congregation
when he goeth in to make an aton in the holi place, until he come
out, and have made an aton for himself, and for hi household,
and for all the congreg of israel.

16:18 and he shall go out unto the altar that is befor the lord, and
mak an aton for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock,
and of the blood of the goat, and put it upon the horn of the altar
round about.

16:19 and he shall sprinkl of the blood upon it with hi finger seven
times, and cleans it, and hallow it from the unclean of the
children of israel.

16:20 and when he hath made an end of reconcil the holi place, and
th tabernacl of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the
liv goat: 16:21 and aaron shall lay both hi hand upon the head of
th live goat, and confess over him all the iniqu of the children
of israel, and all their transgress in all their sins, putting
them upon the head of the goat, and shall send him away by the hand of
a fit man into the wilderness: 16:22 and the goat shall bear upon him
al their iniqu unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go
th goat in the wilderness.

16:23 and aaron shall come into the tabernacl of the congregation,
and shall put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went
into the holi place, and shall leav them there: 16:24 and he shall
wash hi flesh with water in the holi place, and put on hi garments,
and come forth, and offer hi burnt offering, and the burnt offering
of the people, and make an aton for himself, and for the people.

16:25 and the fat of the sin offer shall he burn upon the altar.

16:26 and he that let go the goat for the scapegoat shall wash his
clothes, and bath hi flesh in water, and afterward come into the
camp.

16:27 and the bullock for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin
offering, whose blood wa brought in to make aton in the holy
place, shall one carri forth without the camp; and they shall burn in
th fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.

16:28 and he that burneth them shall wash hi clothes, and bath his
flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.

16:29 and thi shall be a statut for ever unto you: that in the
seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shall afflict your
souls, and do no work at all, whether it be one of your own country,
or a stranger that sojourneth among you: 16:30 for on that day shall
th priest make an aton for you, to cleans you, that ye may be
clean from all your sin befor the lord.

16:31 It shall be a sabbath of rest unto you, and ye shall afflict
your souls, by a statut for ever.

16:32 and the priest, whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall
consecr to minist in the priest' offic in hi father' stead,
shal make the atonement, and shall put on the linen clothes, even the
holi garments: 16:33 and he shall make an aton for the holy
sanctuary, and he shall make an aton for the tabernacl of the
congregation, and for the altar, and he shall make an aton for
th priests, and for all the peopl of the congregation.

16:34 and thi shall be an everlast statut unto you, to make an
aton for the children of israel for all their sin onc a year.
and he did as the lord command moses.

17:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 17:2 speak unto aaron, and
unto hi sons, and unto all the children of israel, and say unto them;
thi is the thing which the lord hath commanded, saying, 17:3 what man
soev there be of the hous of israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb,
or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it out of the camp, 17:4 and
bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacl of the congregation,
to offer an offer unto the lord befor the tabernacl of the lord;
blood shall be imput unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man
shal be cut off from among hi people: 17:5 To the end that the
children of israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the
open field, even that they may bring them unto the lord, unto the door
of the tabernacl of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them
for peac offer unto the lord.

17:6 and the priest shall sprinkl the blood upon the altar of the
lord at the door of the tabernacl of the congregation, and burn the
fat for a sweet savour unto the lord.

17:7 and they shall no more offer their sacrific unto devils, after
whom they have gone a whoring. thi shall be a statut for ever unto
them throughout their generations.

17:8 and thou shalt say unto them, whatsoev man there be of the
hous of israel, or of the stranger which sojourn among you, that
offereth a burnt offer or sacrifice, 17:9 and bringeth it not unto
th door of the tabernacl of the congregation, to offer it unto the
lord; even that man shall be cut off from among hi people.

17:10 and whatsoev man there be of the hous of israel, or of the
strang that sojourn among you, that eateth ani manner of blood; i
wil even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will
cut him off from among hi people.

17:11 for the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it
to you upon the altar to make an aton for your souls: for it is
th blood that maketh an aton for the soul.

17:12 therefor I said unto the children of israel, No soul of you
shal eat blood, neither shall ani stranger that sojourneth among you
eat blood.

17:13 and whatsoev man there be of the children of israel, or of the
strang that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth ani beast
or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof,
and cover it with dust.

17:14 for it is the life of all flesh; the blood of it is for the life
thereof: therefor I said unto the children of israel, Ye shall eat
th blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh is the
blood thereof: whosoev eateth it shall be cut off.

17:15 and everi soul that eateth that which die of itself, or that
which wa torn with beasts, whether it be one of your own country, or
a stranger, he shall both wash hi clothes, and bath himself in
water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.

17:16 but if he wash them not, nor bath hi flesh; then he shall bear
hi iniquity.

18:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 18:2 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, I am the lord your god.

18:3 after the do of the land of egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye
not do: and after the do of the land of canaan, whither I bring
you, shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances.

18:4 Ye shall do my judgments, and keep mine ordinances, to walk
therein: I am the lord your god.

18:5 Ye shall therefor keep my statutes, and my judgments: which if a
man do, he shall live in them: I am the lord.

18:6 none of you shall approach to ani that is near of kin to him, to
uncov their nakedness: I am the lord.

18:7 the naked of thi father, or the naked of thi mother,
shalt thou not uncover: she is thi mother; thou shalt not uncov her
nakedness.

18:8 the naked of thi father' wife shalt thou not uncover: it is
thi father' nakedness.

18:9 the naked of thi sister, the daughter of thi father, or
daught of thi mother, whether she be born at home, or born abroad,
even their naked thou shalt not uncover.

18:10 the naked of thi son' daughter, or of thi daughter's
daughter, even their naked thou shalt not uncover: for their is
thin own nakedness.

18:11 the naked of thi father' wife' daughter, begotten of thy
father, she is thi sister, thou shalt not uncov her nakedness.

18:12 thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi father' sister: she
i thi father' near kinswoman.

18:13 thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi mother' sister: for
sh is thi mother' near kinswoman.

18:14 thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi father' brother,
th shalt not approach to hi wife: she is thine aunt.

18:15 thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi daughter in law: she
i thi son' wife; thou shalt not uncov her nakedness.

18:16 thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi brother' wife: it
i thi brother' nakedness.

18:17 thou shalt not uncov the naked of a woman and her
daughter, neither shalt thou take her son' daughter, or her
daughter' daughter, to uncov her nakedness; for they are her near
kinswomen: it is wickedness.

18:18 neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex her, to
uncov her nakedness, besid the other in her life time.

18:19 also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncov her
nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.

18:20 moreov thou shalt not lie carnal with thi neighbour' wife,
to defil thyself with her.

18:21 and thou shalt not let ani of thi seed pass through the fire to
molech, neither shalt thou profan the name of thi god: I am the lord.

18:22 thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it is
abomination.

18:23 neither shalt thou lie with ani beast to defil thyself
therewith: neither shall ani woman stand befor a beast to lie down
thereto: it is confusion.

18:24 defil not ye yourselv in ani of these things: for in all
thes the nation are defil which I cast out befor you: 18:25 and
th land is defiled: therefor I do visit the iniqu thereof upon
it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

18:26 Ye shall therefor keep my statut and my judgments, and shall
not commit ani of these abominations; neither ani of your own nation,
nor ani stranger that sojourneth among you: 18:27 (for all these
abomin have the men of the land done, which were befor you, and
th land is defiled;) 18:28 that the land spue not you out also, when
y defil it, as it spu out the nation that were befor you.

18:29 for whosoev shall commit ani of these abominations, even the
soul that commit them shall be cut off from among their people.

18:30 therefor shall ye keep mine ordinance, that ye commit not any
on of these abomin customs, which were commit befor you, and
that ye defil not yourselv therein: I am the lord your god.

19:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 19:2 speak unto all the
congreg of the children of israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be
holy: for I the lord your god am holy.

19:3 Ye shall fear everi man hi mother, and hi father, and keep my
sabbaths: I am the lord your god.

19:4 turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselv molten gods: I am
th lord your god.

19:5 and if ye offer a sacrific of peac offer unto the lord, ye
shal offer it at your own will.

19:6 It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow:
and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the
fire.

19:7 and if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it
shal not be accepted.

19:8 therefor everi one that eateth it shall bear hi iniquity,
becaus he hath profan the hallow thing of the lord: and that soul
shal be cut off from among hi people.

19:9 and when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly
reap the corner of thi field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings
of thi harvest.

19:10 and thou shalt not glean thi vineyard, neither shalt thou gather
everi grape of thi vineyard; thou shalt leav them for the poor and
stranger: I am the lord your god.

19:11 Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to
another.

19:12 and ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou
profan the name of thi god: I am the lord.

19:13 thou shalt not defraud thi neighbour, neither rob him: the wages
of him that is hire shall not abid with thee all night until the
morning.

19:14 thou shalt not curs the deaf, nor put a stumblingblock before
th blind, but shalt fear thi god: I am the lord.

19:15 Ye shall do no unright in judgment: thou shalt not
respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty:
but in righteous shalt thou judg thi neighbour.

19:16 thou shalt not go up and down as a talebear among thi people:
neith shalt thou stand against the blood of thi neighbour; I am the
lord.

19:17 thou shalt not hate thi brother in thine heart: thou shalt in
ani wise rebuk thi neighbour, and not suffer sin upon him.

19:18 thou shalt not avenge, nor bear ani grudg against the children
of thi people, but thou shalt love thi neighbour as thyself: I am the
lord.

19:19 Ye shall keep my statutes. thou shalt not let thi cattl gender
with a divers kind: thou shalt not sow thi field with mingl seed:
neith shall a garment mingl of linen and woollen come upon thee.

19:20 and whosoev lieth carnal with a woman, that is a bondmaid,
betroth to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given
her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because
sh wa not free.

19:21 and he shall bring hi trespass offer unto the lord, unto the
door of the tabernacl of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass
offering.

19:22 and the priest shall make an aton for him with the ram of
th trespass offer befor the lord for hi sin which he hath done:
and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

19:23 and when ye shall come into the land, and shall have plant all
mann of tree for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as
uncircumcised: three year shall it be as uncircumcis unto you: it
shal not be eaten of.

19:24 but in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holi to
prais the lord withal.

19:25 and in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it
may yield unto you the increas thereof: I am the lord your god.

19:26 Ye shall not eat ani thing with the blood: neither shall ye use
enchantment, nor observ times.

19:27 Ye shall not round the corner of your heads, neither shalt thou
mar the corner of thi beard.

19:28 Ye shall not make ani cut in your flesh for the dead, nor
print ani mark upon you: I am the lord.

19:29 Do not prostitut thi daughter, to caus her to be a whore; lest
th land fall to whoredom, and the land becom full of wickedness.

19:30 Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and rever my sanctuary: I am the
lord.

19:31 regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after
wizards, to be defil by them: I am the lord your god.

19:32 thou shalt rise up befor the hoari head, and honour the face of
th old man, and fear thi god: I am the lord.

19:33 and if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not
vex him.

19:34 but the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one
born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were
strang in the land of egypt: I am the lord your god.

19:35 Ye shall do no unright in judgment, in meteyard, in
weight, or in measure.

19:36 just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall
y have: I am the lord your god, which brought you out of the land of
egypt.

19:37 therefor shall ye observ all my statutes, and all my
judgments, and do them: I am the lord.

20:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 20:2 again, thou shalt say
to the children of israel, whosoev he be of the children of israel,
or of the stranger that sojourn in israel, that giveth ani of his
se unto molech; he shall sure be put to death: the peopl of the
land shall stone him with stones.

20:3 and I will set my face against that man, and will cut him off
from among hi people; becaus he hath given of hi seed unto molech,
to defil my sanctuary, and to profan my holi name.

20:4 and if the peopl of the land do ani way hide their eye from
th man, when he giveth of hi seed unto molech, and kill him not:
20:5 then I will set my face against that man, and against hi family,
and will cut him off, and all that go a whore after him, to commit
whoredom with molech, from among their people.

20:6 and the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits,
and after wizards, to go a whore after them, I will even set my face
against that soul, and will cut him off from among hi people.

20:7 sanctifi yourselv therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the lord
your god.

20:8 and ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the lord which
sanctifi you.

20:9 for everi one that curseth hi father or hi mother shall be
sur put to death: he hath curs hi father or hi mother; his
blood shall be upon him.

20:10 and the man that committeth adulteri with anoth man' wife,
even he that committeth adulteri with hi neighbour' wife, the
adulter and the adulteress shall sure be put to death.

20:11 and the man that lieth with hi father' wife hath uncov his
father' nakedness: both of them shall sure be put to death; their
blood shall be upon them.

20:12 and if a man lie with hi daughter in law, both of them shall
sur be put to death: they have wrought confusion; their blood shall
b upon them.

20:13 If a man also lie with mankind, as he lieth with a woman, both
of them have commit an abomination: they shall sure be put to
death; their blood shall be upon them.

20:14 and if a man take a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they
shal be burnt with fire, both he and they; that there be no
wicked among you.

20:15 and if a man lie with a beast, he shall sure be put to death:
and ye shall slay the beast.

20:16 and if a woman approach unto ani beast, and lie down thereto,
th shalt kill the woman, and the beast: they shall sure be put to
death; their blood shall be upon them.

20:17 and if a man shall take hi sister, hi father' daughter, or
hi mother' daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his
nakedness; it is a wick thing; and they shall be cut off in the
sight of their people: he hath uncov hi sister' nakedness; he
shal bear hi iniquity.

20:18 and if a man shall lie with a woman have her sickness, and
shal uncov her nakedness; he hath discov her fountain, and she
hath uncov the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be
cut off from among their people.

20:19 and thou shalt not uncov the naked of thi mother' sister,
nor of thi father' sister: for he uncovereth hi near kin: they shall
bear their iniquity.

20:20 and if a man shall lie with hi uncle' wife, he hath uncovered
hi uncle' nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die
childless.

20:21 and if a man shall take hi brother' wife, it is an unclean
thing: he hath uncov hi brother' nakedness; they shall be
childless.

20:22 Ye shall therefor keep all my statutes, and all my judgments,
and do them: that the land, whither I bring you to dwell therein, spue
you not out.

20:23 and ye shall not walk in the manner of the nation, which I cast
out befor you: for they commit all these things, and therefor i
abhor them.

20:24 but I have said unto you, Ye shall inherit their land, and i
wil give it unto you to possess it, a land that floweth with milk and
honey: I am the lord your god, which have separ you from other
people.

20:25 Ye shall therefor put differ between clean beast and
unclean, and between unclean fowl and clean: and ye shall not make
your soul abomin by beast, or by fowl, or by ani manner of living
th that creepeth on the ground, which I have separ from you as
unclean.

20:26 and ye shall be holi unto me: for I the lord am holy, and have
sev you from other people, that ye should be mine.

20:27 A man also or woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a
wizard, shall sure be put to death: they shall stone them with
stones: their blood shall be upon them.

21:1 and the lord said unto moses, speak unto the priest the son of
aaron, and say unto them, there shall none be defil for the dead
among hi people: 21:2 but for hi kin, that is near unto him, that
is, for hi mother, and for hi father, and for hi son, and for his
daughter, and for hi brother.

21:3 and for hi sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath
had no husband; for her may he be defiled.

21:4 but he shall not defil himself, be a chief man among his
people, to profan himself.

21:5 they shall not make bald upon their head, neither shall they
shav off the corner of their beard, nor make ani cut in their
flesh.

21:6 they shall be holi unto their god, and not profan the name of
their god: for the offer of the lord made by fire, and the bread
of their god, they do offer: therefor they shall be holy.

21:7 they shall not take a wife that is a whore, or profane; neither
shal they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holi unto
hi god.

21:8 thou shalt sanctifi him therefore; for he offereth the bread of
thi god: he shall be holi unto thee: for I the lord, which sanctify
you, am holy.

21:9 and the daughter of ani priest, if she profan herself by playing
th whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.

21:10 and he that is the high priest among hi brethren, upon whose
head the anoint oil wa poured, and that is consecr to put on
th garments, shall not uncov hi head, nor rend hi clothes; 21:11
neither shall he go in to ani dead body, nor defil himself for his
father, or for hi mother; 21:12 neither shall he go out of the
sanctuary, nor profan the sanctuari of hi god; for the crown of the
anoint oil of hi god is upon him: I am the lord.

21:13 and he shall take a wife in her virginity.

21:14 A widow, or a divorc woman, or profane, or an harlot, these
shal he not take: but he shall take a virgin of hi own peopl to
wife.

21:15 neither shall he profan hi seed among hi people: for I the
lord do sanctifi him.

21:16 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 21:17 speak unto aaron,
saying, whosoev he be of thi seed in their gener that hath any
blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of hi god.

21:18 for whatsoev man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not
approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any
th superfluous, 21:19 Or a man that is brokenfooted, or
brokenhanded, 21:20 Or crookbackt, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish
in hi eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath hi stone broken; 21:21
no man that hath a blemish of the seed of aaron the priest shall come
nigh to offer the offer of the lord made by fire: he hath a
blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of hi god.

21:22 He shall eat the bread of hi god, both of the most holy, and of
th holy.

21:23 onli he shall not go in unto the vail, nor come nigh unto the
altar, becaus he hath a blemish; that he profan not my sanctuaries:
for I the lord do sanctifi them.

21:24 and mose told it unto aaron, and to hi sons, and unto all the
children of israel.

22:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 22:2 speak unto aaron and
to hi sons, that they separ themselv from the holi thing of the
children of israel, and that they profan not my holi name in those
th which they hallow unto me: I am the lord.

22:3 say unto them, whosoev he be of all your seed among your
generations, that goeth unto the holi things, which the children of
israel hallow unto the lord, have hi unclean upon him, that
soul shall be cut off from my presence: I am the lord.

22:4 what man soever of the seed of aaron is a leper, or hath a
run issue; he shall not eat of the holi things, until he be clean.
and whoso toucheth ani thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man
whos seed goeth from him; 22:5 Or whosoev toucheth ani creeping
thing, wherebi he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take
uncleanness, whatsoev unclean he hath; 22:6 the soul which hath
touch ani such shall be unclean until even, and shall not eat of the
holi things, unless he wash hi flesh with water.

22:7 and when the sun is down, he shall be clean, and shall afterward
eat of the holi things; becaus it is hi food.

22:8 that which dieth of itself, or is torn with beasts, he shall not
eat to defil himself therewith; I am the lord.

22:9 they shall therefor keep mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for
it, and die therefore, if they profan it: I the lord do sanctify
them.

22:10 there shall no stranger eat of the holi thing: a sojourn of
th priest, or an hire servant, shall not eat of the holi thing.

22:11 but if the priest buy ani soul with hi money, he shall eat of
it, and he that is born in hi house: they shall eat of hi meat.

22:12 If the priest' daughter also be marri unto a stranger, she
may not eat of an offer of the holi things.

22:13 but if the priest' daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have
no child, and is return unto her father' house, as in her youth,
sh shall eat of her father' meat: but there shall be no stranger eat
thereof.

22:14 and if a man eat of the holi thing unwittingly, then he shall
put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give it unto the priest
with the holi thing.

22:15 and they shall not profan the holi thing of the children of
israel, which they offer unto the lord; 22:16 Or suffer them to bear
th iniqu of trespass, when they eat their holi things: for I the
lord do sanctifi them.

22:17 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 22:18 speak unto aaron,
and to hi sons, and unto all the children of israel, and say unto
them, whatsoev he be of the hous of israel, or of the stranger in
israel, that will offer hi oblat for all hi vows, and for all his
freewil offerings, which they will offer unto the lord for a burnt
offering; 22:19 Ye shall offer at your own will a male without
blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.

22:20 but whatsoev hath a blemish, that shall ye not offer: for it
shal not be accept for you.

22:21 and whosoev offereth a sacrific of peac offer unto the
lord to accomplish hi vow, or a freewil offer in beev or sheep,
it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.

22:22 blind, or broken, or maimed, or have a wen, or scurvy, or
scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the lord, nor make an offering
bi fire of them upon the altar unto the lord.

22:23 either a bullock or a lamb that hath ani thing superflu or
lack in hi parts, that mayest thou offer for a freewil offering;
but for a vow it shall not be accepted.

22:24 Ye shall not offer unto the lord that which is bruised, or
crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make ani offer thereof
in your land.

22:25 neither from a stranger' hand shall ye offer the bread of your
god of ani of these; becaus their corrupt is in them, and
blemish be in them: they shall not be accept for you.

22:26 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 22:27 when a bullock, or
a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days
und the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be
accept for an offer made by fire unto the lord.

22:28 and whether it be cow, or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her
young both in one day.

22:29 and when ye will offer a sacrific of thanksgiv unto the
lord, offer it at your own will.

22:30 On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leav none of it
until the morrow: I am the lord.

22:31 therefor shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the
lord.

22:32 neither shall ye profan my holi name; but I will be hallowed
among the children of israel: I am the lord which hallow you, 22:33
that brought you out of the land of egypt, to be your god: I am the
lord.

23:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 23:2 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, concern the feast of the
lord, which ye shall proclaim to be holi convocations, even these are
mi feasts.

23:3 six day shall work be done: but the seventh day is the sabbath
of rest, an holi convocation; ye shall do no work therein: it is the
sabbath of the lord in all your dwellings.

23:4 these are the feast of the lord, even holi convocations, which
y shall proclaim in their seasons.

23:5 In the fourteenth day of the first month at even is the lord's
passover.

23:6 and on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of
unleaven bread unto the lord: seven day ye must eat unleavened
bread.

23:7 In the first day ye shall have an holi convocation: ye shall do
no servil work therein.

23:8 but ye shall offer an offer made by fire unto the lord seven
days: in the seventh day is an holi convocation: ye shall do no
servil work therein.

23:9 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 23:10 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, when ye be come into the land
which I give unto you, and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye
shal bring a sheaf of the firstfruit of your harvest unto the
priest: 23:11 and he shall wave the sheaf befor the lord, to be
accept for you: on the morrow after the sabbath the priest shall
wav it.

23:12 and ye shall offer that day when ye wave the sheaf an he lamb
without blemish of the first year for a burnt offer unto the lord.

23:13 and the meat offer thereof shall be two tenth deal of fine
flour mingl with oil, an offer made by fire unto the lord for a
sweet savour: and the drink offer thereof shall be of wine, the
fourth part of an hin.

23:14 and ye shall eat neither bread, nor parch corn, nor green
ears, until the selfsam day that ye have brought an offer unto
your god: it shall be a statut for ever throughout your generations
in all your dwellings.

23:15 and ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath,
from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven
sabbath shall be complete: 23:16 even unto the morrow after the
seventh sabbath shall ye number fifti days; and ye shall offer a new
meat offer unto the lord.

23:17 Ye shall bring out of your habit two wave loav of two
tenth deals; they shall be of fine flour; they shall be baken with
leaven; they are the firstfruit unto the lord.

23:18 and ye shall offer with the bread seven lamb without blemish of
th first year, and one young bullock, and two rams: they shall be for
a burnt offer unto the lord, with their meat offering, and their
drink offerings, even an offer made by fire, of sweet savour unto
th lord.

23:19 then ye shall sacrific one kid of the goat for a sin offering,
and two lamb of the first year for a sacrific of peac offerings.

23:20 and the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits
for a wave offer befor the lord, with the two lambs: they shall be
holi to the lord for the priest.

23:21 and ye shall proclaim on the selfsam day, that it may be an
holi convoc unto you: ye shall do no servil work therein: it
shal be a statut for ever in all your dwell throughout your
generations.

23:22 and when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not make
clean riddanc of the corner of thi field when thou reapest, neither
shalt thou gather ani glean of thi harvest: thou shalt leav them
unto the poor, and to the stranger: I am the lord your god.

23:23 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 23:24 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first day of
th month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memori of blow of trumpets,
an holi convocation.

23:25 Ye shall do no servil work therein: but ye shall offer an
off made by fire unto the lord.

23:26 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 23:27 also on the tenth
day of thi seventh month there shall be a day of atonement: it shall
b an holi convoc unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and
off an offer made by fire unto the lord.

23:28 and ye shall do no work in that same day: for it is a day of
atonement, to make an aton for you befor the lord your god.

23:29 for whatsoev soul it be that shall not be afflict in that
sam day, he shall be cut off from among hi people.

23:30 and whatsoev soul it be that doeth ani work in that same day,
th same soul will I destroy from among hi people.

23:31 Ye shall do no manner of work: it shall be a statut for ever
throughout your gener in all your dwellings.

23:32 It shall be unto you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict
your souls: in the ninth day of the month at even, from even unto
even, shall ye celebr your sabbath.

23:33 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 23:34 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, the fifteenth day of thi seventh month
shal be the feast of tabernacl for seven day unto the lord.

23:35 On the first day shall be an holi convocation: ye shall do no
servil work therein.

23:36 seven day ye shall offer an offer made by fire unto the
lord: on the eighth day shall be an holi convoc unto you; and ye
shal offer an offer made by fire unto the lord: it is a solemn
assembly; and ye shall do no servil work therein.

23:37 these are the feast of the lord, which ye shall proclaim to be
holi convocations, to offer an offer made by fire unto the lord, a
burnt offering, and a meat offering, a sacrifice, and drink offerings,
everi thing upon hi day: 23:38 besid the sabbath of the lord, and
besid your gifts, and besid all your vows, and besid all your
freewil offerings, which ye give unto the lord.

23:39 also in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have
gath in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep a feast unto the lord
seven days: on the first day shall be a sabbath, and on the eighth day
shal be a sabbath.

23:40 and ye shall take you on the first day the bough of goodly
trees, branch of palm trees, and the bough of thick trees, and
willow of the brook; and ye shall rejoic befor the lord your god
seven days.

23:41 and ye shall keep it a feast unto the lord seven day in the
year.

it shall be a statut for ever in your generations: ye shall celebrate
it in the seventh month.

23:42 Ye shall dwell in booth seven days; all that are israelites
born shall dwell in booths: 23:43 that your gener may know that
i made the children of israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them
out of the land of egypt: I am the lord your god.

23:44 and mose declar unto the children of israel the feast of the
lord.

24:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 24:2 command the children
of israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil oliv beaten for the
light, to caus the lamp to burn continually.

24:3 without the vail of the testimony, in the tabernacl of the
congregation, shall aaron order it from the even unto the morning
befor the lord continually: it shall be a statut for ever in your
generations.

24:4 He shall order the lamp upon the pure candlestick befor the
lord continually.

24:5 and thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelv cake thereof:
two tenth deal shall be in one cake.

24:6 and thou shalt set them in two rows, six on a row, upon the pure
t befor the lord.

24:7 and thou shalt put pure frankincens upon each row, that it may
b on the bread for a memorial, even an offer made by fire unto the
lord.

24:8 everi sabbath he shall set it in order befor the lord
continually, be taken from the children of israel by an everlasting
covenant.

24:9 and it shall be aaron' and hi sons'; and they shall eat it in
th holi place: for it is most holi unto him of the offer of the
lord made by fire by a perpetu statute.

24:10 and the son of an israelitish woman, whose father wa an
egyptian, went out among the children of israel: and thi son of the
israelitish woman and a man of israel strove togeth in the camp;
24:11 and the israelitish woman' son blasphem the name of the lord,
and cursed. and they brought him unto moses: (and hi mother' name
wa shelomith, the daughter of dibri, of the tribe of dan:) 24:12 and
they put him in ward, that the mind of the lord might be shew them.

24:13 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 24:14 bring forth him
that hath curs without the camp; and let all that heard him lay
their hand upon hi head, and let all the congreg stone him.

24:15 and thou shalt speak unto the children of israel, saying,
whosoev curseth hi god shall bear hi sin.

24:16 and he that blasphemeth the name of the lord, he shall sure be
put to death, and all the congreg shall certainli stone him: as
wel the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth
