th name of the lord, shall be put to death.

24:17 and he that killeth ani man shall sure be put to death.

24:18 and he that killeth a beast shall make it good; beast for beast.

24:19 and if a man caus a blemish in hi neighbour; as he hath done,
so shall it be done to him; 24:20 breach for breach, eye for eye,
tooth for tooth: as he hath caus a blemish in a man, so shall it be
don to him again.

24:21 and he that killeth a beast, he shall restor it: and he that
killeth a man, he shall be put to death.

24:22 Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as
for one of your own country: for I am the lord your god.

24:23 and mose spake to the children of israel, that they should
br forth him that had curs out of the camp, and stone him with
stones. and the children of israel did as the lord command moses.

25:1 and the lord spake unto mose in mount sinai, saying, 25:2 speak
unto the children of israel, and say unto them, when ye come into the
land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath unto the
lord.

25:3 six year thou shalt sow thi field, and six year thou shalt
prun thi vineyard, and gather in the fruit thereof; 25:4 but in the
seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for
th lord: thou shalt neither sow thi field, nor prune thi vineyard.

25:5 that which groweth of it own accord of thi harvest thou shalt
not reap, neither gather the grape of thi vine undressed: for it is a
year of rest unto the land.

25:6 and the sabbath of the land shall be meat for you; for thee, and
for thi servant, and for thi maid, and for thi hire servant, and for
thi stranger that sojourneth with thee.

25:7 and for thi cattle, and for the beast that are in thi land, shall
al the increas thereof be meat.

25:8 and thou shalt number seven sabbath of year unto thee, seven
tim seven years; and the space of the seven sabbath of year shall
b unto thee forti and nine years.

25:9 then shalt thou caus the trumpet of the jubil to sound on the
tenth day of the seventh month, in the day of aton shall ye make
th trumpet sound throughout all your land.

25:10 and ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty
throughout all the land unto all the inhabit thereof: it shall be
a jubil unto you; and ye shall return everi man unto hi possession,
and ye shall return everi man unto hi family.

25:11 A jubil shall that fiftieth year be unto you: ye shall not sow,
neith reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes
in it of thi vine undressed.

25:12 for it is the jubile; it shall be holi unto you: ye shall eat
th increas thereof out of the field.

25:13 In the year of thi jubil ye shall return everi man unto his
possession.

25:14 and if thou sell ought unto thi neighbour, or buyest ought of
thi neighbour' hand, ye shall not oppress one another: 25:15
accord to the number of year after the jubil thou shalt buy of
thi neighbour, and accord unto the number of year of the fruit he
shal sell unto thee: 25:16 accord to the multitud of year thou
shalt increas the price thereof, and accord to the few of
year thou shalt diminish the price of it: for accord to the number
of the year of the fruit doth he sell unto thee.

25:17 Ye shall not therefor oppress one another; but thou shalt fear
thi god:for I am the lord your god.

25:18 wherefor ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do
them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.

25:19 and the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill,
and dwell therein in safety.

25:20 and if ye shall say, what shall we eat the seventh year? behold,
w shall not sow, nor gather in our increase: 25:21 then I will
command my bless upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring
forth fruit for three years.

25:22 and ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat yet of old fruit until
th ninth year; until her fruit come in ye shall eat of the old
store.

25:23 the land shall not be sold for ever: for the land is mine, for
y are stranger and sojourn with me.

25:24 and in all the land of your possess ye shall grant a
redempt for the land.

25:25 If thi brother be waxen poor, and hath sold away some of his
possession, and if ani of hi kin come to redeem it, then shall he
redeem that which hi brother sold.

25:26 and if the man have none to redeem it, and himself be abl to
redeem it; 25:27 then let him count the year of the sale thereof, and
restor the overplu unto the man to whom he sold it; that he may
return unto hi possession.

25:28 but if he be not abl to restor it to him, then that which is
sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the
year of jubile: and in the jubil it shall go out, and he shall return
unto hi possession.

25:29 and if a man sell a dwell hous in a wall city, then he may
redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year may
h redeem it.

25:30 and if it be not redeem within the space of a full year, then
th hous that is in the wall citi shall be establish for ever to
him that bought it throughout hi generations: it shall not go out in
th jubile.

25:31 but the hous of the villag which have no wall round about
them shall be count as the field of the country: they may be
redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubile.

25:32 notwithstand the citi of the levites, and the hous of the
citi of their possession, may the levit redeem at ani time.

25:33 and if a man purchas of the levites, then the hous that was
sold, and the citi of hi possession, shall go out in the year of
jubile: for the hous of the citi of the levit are their
possess among the children of israel.

25:34 but the field of the suburb of their citi may not be sold;
for it is their perpetu possession.

25:35 and if thi brother be waxen poor, and fallen in decay with thee;
then thou shalt reliev him: yea, though he be a stranger, or a
sojourner; that he may live with thee.

25:36 take thou no usuri of him, or increase: but fear thi god; that
thi brother may live with thee.

25:37 thou shalt not give him thi money upon usury, nor lend him thy
victu for increase.

25:38 I am the lord your god, which brought you forth out of the land
of egypt, to give you the land of canaan, and to be your god.

25:39 and if thi brother that dwelleth by thee be waxen poor, and be
sold unto thee; thou shalt not compel him to serv as a bondservant:
25:40 but as an hire servant, and as a sojourner, he shall be with
thee, and shall serv thee unto the year of jubile.

25:41 and then shall he depart from thee, both he and hi children
with him, and shall return unto hi own family, and unto the
possess of hi father shall he return.

25:42 for they are my servants, which I brought forth out of the land
of egypt: they shall not be sold as bondmen.

25:43 thou shalt not rule over him with rigour; but shalt fear thy
god.

25:44 both thi bondmen, and thi bondmaids, which thou shalt have,
shal be of the heathen that are round about you; of them shall ye buy
bondmen and bondmaids.

25:45 moreov of the children of the stranger that do sojourn among
you, of them shall ye buy, and of their famili that are with you,
which they begat in your land: and they shall be your possession.

25:46 and ye shall take them as an inherit for your children after
you, to inherit them for a possession; they shall be your bondmen for
ever: but over your brethren the children of israel, ye shall not rule
on over anoth with rigour.

25:47 and if a sojourn or stranger wax rich by thee, and thi brother
that dwelleth by him wax poor, and sell himself unto the stranger or
sojourn by thee, or to the stock of the stranger' family: 25:48
after that he is sold he may be redeem again; one of hi brethren
may redeem him: 25:49 either hi uncle, or hi uncle' son, may redeem
him, or ani that is nigh of kin unto him of hi famili may redeem him;
or if he be able, he may redeem himself.

25:50 and he shall reckon with him that bought him from the year that
h wa sold to him unto the year of jubile: and the price of hi sale
shal be accord unto the number of years, accord to the time of
an hire servant shall it be with him.

25:51 If there be yet mani year behind, accord unto them he shall
giv again the price of hi redempt out of the money that he was
bought for.

25:52 and if there remain but few year unto the year of jubile, then
h shall count with him, and accord unto hi year shall he give
him again the price of hi redemption.

25:53 and as a yearli hire servant shall he be with him: and the
oth shall not rule with rigour over him in thi sight.

25:54 and if he be not redeem in these years, then he shall go out
in the year of jubile, both he, and hi children with him.

25:55 for unto me the children of israel are servants; they are my
serv whom I brought forth out of the land of egypt: I am the lord
your god.

26:1 Ye shall make you no idol nor graven image, neither rear you up
a stand image, neither shall ye set up ani imag of stone in your
land, to bow down unto it: for I am the lord your god.

26:2 Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and rever my sanctuary: I am the
lord.

26:3 If ye walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them;
26:4 then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield
her increase, and the tree of the field shall yield their fruit.

26:5 and your thresh shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage
shal reach unto the sow time: and ye shall eat your bread to the
full, and dwell in your land safely.

26:6 and I will give peac in the land, and ye shall lie down, and
non shall make you afraid: and I will rid evil beast out of the
land, neither shall the sword go through your land.

26:7 and ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall befor you
bi the sword.

26:8 and five of you shall chase an hundred, and an hundr of you
shal put ten thousand to flight: and your enemi shall fall before
y by the sword.

26:9 for I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and
multipli you, and establish my coven with you.

26:10 and ye shall eat old store, and bring forth the old becaus of
th new.

26:11 and I set my tabernacl among you: and my soul shall not abhor
you.

26:12 and I will walk among you, and will be your god, and ye shall be
mi people.

26:13 I am the lord your god, which brought you forth out of the land
of egypt, that ye should not be their bondmen; and I have broken the
band of your yoke, and made you go upright.

26:14 but if ye will not hearken unto me, and will not do all these
commandments; 26:15 and if ye shall despis my statutes, or if your
soul abhor my judgments, so that ye will not do all my commandments,
but that ye break my covenant: 26:16 I also will do thi unto you; i
wil even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burn ague,
that shall consum the eyes, and caus sorrow of heart: and ye shall
sow your seed in vain, for your enemi shall eat it.

26:17 and I will set my face against you, and ye shall be slain before
your enemies: they that hate you shall reign over you; and ye shall
fle when none pursueth you.

26:18 and if ye will not yet for all thi hearken unto me, then I will
punish you seven time more for your sins.

26:19 and I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your
heaven as iron, and your earth as brass: 26:20 and your strength shall
b spent in vain: for your land shall not yield her increase, neither
shal the tree of the land yield their fruits.

26:21 and if ye walk contrari unto me, and will not hearken unto me; i
wil bring seven time more plagu upon you accord to your sins.

26:22 I will also send wild beast among you, which shall rob you of
your children, and destroy your cattle, and make you few in number;
and your high way shall be desolate.

26:23 and if ye will not be reform by me by these things, but will
walk contrari unto me; 26:24 then will I also walk contrari unto you,
and will punish you yet seven time for your sins.

26:25 and I will bring a sword upon you, that shall aveng the quarrel
of my covenant: and when ye are gather togeth within your cities,
i will send the pestil among you; and ye shall be deliv into
th hand of the enemy.

26:26 and when I have broken the staff of your bread, ten women shall
bak your bread in one oven, and they shall deliv you your bread
again by weight: and ye shall eat, and not be satisfied.

26:27 and if ye will not for all thi hearken unto me, but walk
contrari unto me; 26:28 then I will walk contrari unto you also in
fury; and I, even I, will chastis you seven time for your sins.

26:29 and ye shall eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your
daught shall ye eat.

26:30 and I will destroy your high places, and cut down your images,
and cast your carcas upon the carcas of your idols, and my soul
shal abhor you.

26:31 and I will make your citi waste, and bring your sanctuaries
unto desolation, and I will not smell the savour of your sweet odours.

26:32 and I will bring the land into desolation: and your enemies
which dwell therein shall be astonish at it.

26:33 and I will scatter you among the heathen, and will draw out a
sword after you: and your land shall be desolate, and your cities
waste.

26:34 then shall the land enjoy her sabbaths, as long as it lieth
desolate, and ye be in your enemies' land; even then shall the land
rest, and enjoy her sabbaths.

26:35 As long as it lieth desol it shall rest; becaus it did not
rest in your sabbaths, when ye dwelt upon it.

26:36 and upon them that are left aliv of you I will send a faintness
into their heart in the land of their enemies; and the sound of a
shaken leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee, as flee from a
sword; and they shall fall when none pursueth.

26:37 and they shall fall one upon another, as it were befor a sword,
when none pursueth: and ye shall have no power to stand befor your
enemies.

26:38 and ye shall perish among the heathen, and the land of your
enemi shall eat you up.

26:39 and they that are left of you shall pine away in their iniquity
in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniqu of their fathers
shal they pine away with them.

26:40 If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniqu of their
fathers, with their trespass which they trespass against me, and
that also they have walk contrari unto me; 26:41 and that I also
hav walk contrari unto them, and have brought them into the land of
their enemies; if then their uncircumcis heart be humbled, and they
then accept of the punish of their iniquity: 26:42 then will i
rememb my coven with jacob, and also my coven with isaac, and
also my coven with abraham will I remember; and I will rememb the
land.

26:43 the land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her
sabbaths, while she lieth desol without them: and they shall accept
of the punish of their iniquity: because, even becaus they
despis my judgments, and becaus their soul abhor my statutes.

26:44 and yet for all that, when they be in the land of their enemies,
i will not cast them away, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them
utterly, and to break my coven with them: for I am the lord their
god.

26:45 but I will for their sake rememb the coven of their
ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of egypt in the sight
of the heathen, that I might be their god: I am the lord.

26:46 these are the statut and judgment and laws, which the lord
mad between him and the children of israel in mount sinai by the hand
of moses.

27:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 27:2 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, when a man shall make a
singular vow, the person shall be for the lord by thi estimation.

27:3 and thi estim shall be of the male from twenti year old
even unto sixti year old, even thi estim shall be fifti shekels
of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

27:4 and if it be a female, then thi estim shall be thirty
shekels.

27:5 and if it be from five year old even unto twenti year old, then
thi estim shall be of the male twenti shekels, and for the female
ten shekels.

27:6 and if it be from a month old even unto five year old, then thy
estim shall be of the male five shekel of silver, and for the
femal thi estim shall be three shekel of silver.

27:7 and if it be from sixti year old and above; if it be a male,
then thi estim shall be fifteen shekels, and for the femal ten
shekels.

27:8 but if he be poorer than thi estimation, then he shall present
himself befor the priest, and the priest shall valu him; according
to hi abil that vow shall the priest valu him.

27:9 and if it be a beast, whereof men bring an offer unto the
lord, all that ani man giveth of such unto the lord shall be holy.

27:10 He shall not alter it, nor chang it, a good for a bad, or a bad
for a good: and if he shall at all chang beast for beast, then it and
th exchang thereof shall be holy.

27:11 and if it be ani unclean beast, of which they do not offer a
sacrific unto the lord, then he shall present the beast befor the
priest: 27:12 and the priest shall valu it, whether it be good or
bad: as thou valuest it, who art the priest, so shall it be.

27:13 but if he will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifth part
thereof unto thi estimation.

27:14 and when a man shall sanctifi hi hous to be holi unto the
lord, then the priest shall estim it, whether it be good or bad: as
th priest shall estim it, so shall it stand.

27:15 and if he that sanctifi it will redeem hi house, then he
shal add the fifth part of the money of thi estim unto it, and
it shall be his.

27:16 and if a man shall sanctifi unto the lord some part of a field
of hi possession, then thi estim shall be accord to the seed
thereof: an homer of barley seed shall be valu at fifti shekel of
silver.

27:17 If he sanctifi hi field from the year of jubile, accord to
thi estim it shall stand.

27:18 but if he sanctifi hi field after the jubile, then the priest
shal reckon unto him the money accord to the year that remain,
even unto the year of the jubile, and it shall be abat from thy
estimation.

27:19 and if he that sanctifi the field will in ani wise redeem it,
then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thi estim unto
it, and it shall be assur to him.

27:20 and if he will not redeem the field, or if he have sold the
field to anoth man, it shall not be redeem ani more.

27:21 but the field, when it goeth out in the jubile, shall be holy
unto the lord, as a field devoted; the possess thereof shall be the
priest's.

27:22 and if a man sanctifi unto the lord a field which he hath
bought, which is not of the field of hi possession; 27:23 then the
priest shall reckon unto him the worth of thi estimation, even unto
th year of the jubile: and he shall give thine estim in that
day, as a holi thing unto the lord.

27:24 In the year of the jubil the field shall return unto him of
whom it wa bought, even to him to whom the possess of the land did
belong.

27:25 and all thi estim shall be accord to the shekel of the
sanctuary: twenti gerah shall be the shekel.

27:26 onli the firstl of the beasts, which should be the lord's
firstling, no man shall sanctifi it; whether it be ox, or sheep: it is
th lord's.

27:27 and if it be of an unclean beast, then he shall redeem it
accord to thine estimation, and shall add a fifth part of it
thereto: or if it be not redeemed, then it shall be sold accord to
thi estimation.

27:28 notwithstand no devot thing, that a man shall devot unto
th lord of all that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field
of hi possession, shall be sold or redeemed: everi devot thing is
most holi unto the lord.

27:29 none devoted, which shall be devot of men, shall be redeemed;
but shall sure be put to death.

27:30 and all the tith of the land, whether of the seed of the land,
or of the fruit of the tree, is the lord's: it is holi unto the lord.

27:31 and if a man will at all redeem ought of hi tithes, he shall
add thereto the fifth part thereof.

27:32 and concern the tith of the herd, or of the flock, even of
whatsoev passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holi unto the
lord.

27:33 He shall not search whether it be good or bad, neither shall he
chang it: and if he chang it at all, then both it and the change
thereof shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.

27:34 these are the commandments, which the lord command mose for
th children of israel in mount sinai.




th fourth book of moses:  call numbers


1:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai, in the
tabernacl of the congregation, on the first day of the second month,
in the second year after they were come out of the land of egypt,
saying, 1:2 take ye the sum of all the congreg of the children of
israel, after their families, by the hous of their fathers, with the
numb of their names, everi male by their polls; 1:3 from twenty
year old and upward, all that are abl to go forth to war in israel:
th and aaron shall number them by their armies.

1:4 and with you there shall be a man of everi tribe; everi one head
of the hous of hi fathers.

1:5 and these are the name of the men that shall stand with you: of
th tribe of reuben; elizur the son of shedeur.

1:6 Of simeon; shelumiel the son of zurishaddai.

1:7 Of judah; nahshon the son of amminadab.

1:8 Of issachar; nethaneel the son of zuar.

1:9 Of zebulun; eliab the son of helon.

1:10 Of the children of joseph: of ephraim; elishama the son of
ammihud: of manasseh; gamaliel the son of pedahzur.

1:11 Of benjamin; abidan the son of gideoni.

1:12 Of dan; ahiez the son of ammishaddai.

1:13 Of asher; pagiel the son of ocran.

1:14 Of gad; eliasaph the son of deuel.

1:15 Of naphtali; ahira the son of enan.

1:16 these were the renown of the congregation, princ of the
trib of their fathers, head of thousand in israel.

1:17 and mose and aaron took these men which are express by their
names: 1:18 and they assembl all the congreg togeth on the
first day of the second month, and they declar their pedigre after
their families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number
of the names, from twenti year old and upward, by their polls.

1:19 As the lord command moses, so he number them in the
wild of sinai.

1:20 and the children of reuben, israel' eldest son, by their
generations, after their families, by the hous of their fathers,
accord to the number of the names, by their polls, everi male from
twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go forth to war;
1:21 those that were number of them, even of the tribe of reuben,
wer forti and six thousand and five hundred.

1:22 Of the children of simeon, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, those that were number of
them, accord to the number of the names, by their polls, everi male
from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go forth to
war; 1:23 those that were number of them, even of the tribe of
simeon, were fifti and nine thousand and three hundred.

1:24 Of the children of gad, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:25 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of gad, were forti and five thousand six hundr and fifty.

1:26 Of the children of judah, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:27 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of judah, were threescor and fourteen thousand and six hundred.

1:28 Of the children of issachar, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:29 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of issachar, were fifti and four thousand and four hundred.

1:30 Of the children of zebulun, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:31 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of zebulun, were fifti and seven thousand and four hundred.

1:32 Of the children of joseph, namely, of the children of ephraim, by
their generations, after their families, by the hous of their
fathers, accord to the number of the names, from twenti year old
and upward, all that were abl to go forth to war; 1:33 those that
wer number of them, even of the tribe of ephraim, were forty
thousand and five hundred.

1:34 Of the children of manasseh, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:35 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of manasseh, were thirti and two thousand and two hundred.

1:36 Of the children of benjamin, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:37 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of benjamin, were thirti and five thousand and four hundred.

1:38 Of the children of dan, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:39 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of dan, were threescor and two thousand and seven hundred.

1:40 Of the children of asher, by their generations, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number of
th names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to go
forth to war; 1:41 those that were number of them, even of the tribe
of asher, were forti and one thousand and five hundred.

1:42 Of the children of naphtali, throughout their generations, after
their families, by the hous of their fathers, accord to the number
of the names, from twenti year old and upward, all that were abl to
go forth to war; 1:43 those that were number of them, even of the
trib of naphtali, were fifti and three thousand and four hundred.

1:44 these are those that were numbered, which mose and aaron
numbered, and the princ of israel, be twelv men: each one was
for the hous of hi fathers.

1:45 So were all those that were number of the children of israel,
bi the hous of their fathers, from twenti year old and upward, all
that were abl to go forth to war in israel; 1:46 even all they that
wer number were six hundr thousand and three thousand and five
hundr and fifty.

1:47 but the levit after the tribe of their father were not
numb among them.

1:48 for the lord had spoken unto moses, saying, 1:49 onli thou shalt
not number the tribe of levi, neither take the sum of them among the
children of israel: 1:50 but thou shalt appoint the levit over the
tabernacl of testimony, and over all the vessel thereof, and over
al thing that belong to it: they shall bear the tabernacle, and all
th vessel thereof; and they shall minist unto it, and shall encamp
round about the tabernacle.

1:51 and when the tabernacl setteth forward, the levit shall take
it down: and when the tabernacl is to be pitched, the levit shall
set it up: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

1:52 and the children of israel shall pitch their tents, everi man by
hi own camp, and everi man by hi own standard, throughout their
hosts.

1:53 but the levit shall pitch round about the tabernacl of
testimony, that there be no wrath upon the congreg of the
children of israel: and the levit shall keep the charg of the
tabernacl of testimony.

1:54 and the children of israel did accord to all that the lord
command moses, so did they.

2:1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 2:2 every
man of the children of israel shall pitch by hi own standard, with
th ensign of their father' house: far off about the tabernacl of
th congreg shall they pitch.

2:3 and on the east side toward the rise of the sun shall they of
th standard of the camp of judah pitch throughout their armies: and
nahshon the son of amminadab shall be captain of the children of
judah.

2:4 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were
threescor and fourteen thousand and six hundred.

2:5 and those that do pitch next unto him shall be the tribe of
issachar: and nethaneel the son of zuar shall be captain of the
children of issachar.

2:6 and hi host, and those that were number thereof, were fifti and
four thousand and four hundred.

2:7 then the tribe of zebulun: and eliab the son of helon shall be
captain of the children of zebulun.

2:8 and hi host, and those that were number thereof, were fifti and
seven thousand and four hundred.

2:9 all that were number in the camp of judah were an hundred
thousand and fourscor thousand and six thousand and four hundred,
throughout their armies. these shall first set forth.

2:10 On the south side shall be the standard of the camp of reuben
accord to their armies: and the captain of the children of reuben
shal be elizur the son of shedeur.

2:11 and hi host, and those that were number thereof, were forty
and six thousand and five hundred.

2:12 and those which pitch by him shall be the tribe of simeon: and
th captain of the children of simeon shall be shelumiel the son of
zurishaddai.

2:13 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were fifty
and nine thousand and three hundred.

2:14 then the tribe of gad: and the captain of the son of gad shall
b eliasaph the son of reuel.

2:15 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were forty
and five thousand and six hundr and fifty.

2:16 all that were number in the camp of reuben were an hundred
thousand and fifti and one thousand and four hundr and fifty,
throughout their armies. and they shall set forth in the second rank.

2:17 then the tabernacl of the congreg shall set forward with
th camp of the levit in the midst of the camp: as they encamp, so
shal they set forward, everi man in hi place by their standards.

2:18 On the west side shall be the standard of the camp of ephraim
accord to their armies: and the captain of the son of ephraim
shal be elishama the son of ammihud.

2:19 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were forty
thousand and five hundred.

2:20 and by him shall be the tribe of manasseh: and the captain of the
children of manasseh shall be gamaliel the son of pedahzur.

2:21 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were thirty
and two thousand and two hundred.

2:22 then the tribe of benjamin: and the captain of the son of
benjamin shall be abidan the son of gideoni.

2:23 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were thirty
and five thousand and four hundred.

2:24 all that were number of the camp of ephraim were an hundred
thousand and eight thousand and an hundred, throughout their armies.
and they shall go forward in the third rank.

2:25 the standard of the camp of dan shall be on the north side by
their armies: and the captain of the children of dan shall be ahiezer
th son of ammishaddai.

2:26 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were
threescor and two thousand and seven hundred.

2:27 and those that encamp by him shall be the tribe of asher: and the
captain of the children of asher shall be pagiel the son of ocran.

2:28 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were forty
and one thousand and five hundred.

2:29 then the tribe of naphtali: and the captain of the children of
naphtali shall be ahira the son of enan.

2:30 and hi host, and those that were number of them, were fifty
and three thousand and four hundred.

2:31 all they that were number in the camp of dan were an hundred
thousand and fifti and seven thousand and six hundred. they shall go
hindmost with their standards.

2:32 these are those which were number of the children of israel by
th hous of their fathers: all those that were number of the camps
throughout their host were six hundr thousand and three thousand
and five hundr and fifty.

2:33 but the levit were not number among the children of israel;
a the lord command moses.

2:34 and the children of israel did accord to all that the lord
command moses: so they pitch by their standards, and so they set
forward, everi one after their families, accord to the hous of
their fathers.

3:1 these also are the gener of aaron and mose in the day that
th lord spake with mose in mount sinai.

3:2 and these are the name of the son of aaron; nadab the firstborn,
and abihu, eleazar, and ithamar.

3:3 these are the name of the son of aaron, the priest which were
anointed, whom he consecr to minist in the priest' office.

3:4 and nadab and abihu die befor the lord, when they offered
strang fire befor the lord, in the wilder of sinai, and they had
no children: and eleazar and ithamar minist in the priest' office
in the sight of aaron their father.

3:5 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 3:6 bring the tribe of levi
near, and present them befor aaron the priest, that they may minister
unto him.

3:7 and they shall keep hi charge, and the charg of the whole
congreg befor the tabernacl of the congregation, to do the
servic of the tabernacle.

3:8 and they shall keep all the instrument of the tabernacl of the
congregation, and the charg of the children of israel, to do the
servic of the tabernacle.

3:9 and thou shalt give the levit unto aaron and to hi sons: they
ar wholli given unto him out of the children of israel.

3:10 and thou shalt appoint aaron and hi sons, and they shall wait on
their priest' office: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put
to death.

3:11 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 3:12 and I, behold, I have
taken the levit from among the children of israel instead of all the
firstborn that openeth the matrix among the children of israel:
therefor the levit shall be mine; 3:13 becaus all the firstborn
ar mine; for on the day that I smote all the firstborn in the land of
egypt I hallow unto me all the firstborn in israel, both man and
beast: mine shall they be: I am the lord.

3:14 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai, saying,
3:15 number the children of levi after the hous of their fathers, by
their families: everi male from a month old and upward shalt thou
numb them.

3:16 and mose number them accord to the word of the lord, as he
wa commanded.

3:17 and these were the son of levi by their names; gershon, and
kohath, and merari.

3:18 and these are the name of the son of gershon by their families;
libni, and shimei.

3:19 and the son of kohath by their families; amram, and izehar,
hebron, and uzziel.

3:20 and the son of merari by their families; mahli, and mushi. these
ar the famili of the levit accord to the hous of their
fathers.

3:21 Of gershon wa the famili of the libnites, and the famili of the
shimites: these are the famili of the gershonites.

3:22 those that were number of them, accord to the number of all
th males, from a month old and upward, even those that were numbered
of them were seven thousand and five hundred.

3:23 the famili of the gershonit shall pitch behind the tabernacle
westward.

3:24 and the chief of the hous of the father of the gershonit shall
b eliasaph the son of lael.

3:25 and the charg of the son of gershon in the tabernacl of the
congreg shall be the tabernacle, and the tent, the covering
thereof, and the hang for the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation, 3:26 and the hang of the court, and the curtain for
th door of the court, which is by the tabernacle, and by the altar
round about, and the cord of it for all the servic thereof.

3:27 and of kohath wa the famili of the amramites, and the famili of
th izeharites, and the famili of the hebronites, and the famili of
th uzzielites: these are the famili of the kohathites.

3:28 In the number of all the males, from a month old and upward, were
eight thousand and six hundred, keep the charg of the sanctuary.

3:29 the famili of the son of kohath shall pitch on the side of the
tabernacl southward.

3:30 and the chief of the hous of the father of the famili of the
kohathit shall be elizaphan the son of uzziel.

3:31 and their charg shall be the ark, and the table, and the
candlestick, and the altars, and the vessel of the sanctuary
wherewith they minister, and the hanging, and all the servic thereof.

3:32 and eleazar the son of aaron the priest shall be chief over the
chief of the levites, and have the oversight of them that keep the
charg of the sanctuary.

3:33 Of merari wa the famili of the mahlites, and the famili of the
mushites: these are the famili of merari.

3:34 and those that were number of them, accord to the number of
al the males, from a month old and upward, were six thousand and two
hundred.

3:35 and the chief of the hous of the father of the famili of
merari wa zuriel the son of abihail: these shall pitch on the side of
th tabernacl northward.

3:36 and under the custodi and charg of the son of merari shall be
th board of the tabernacle, and the bar thereof, and the pillars
thereof, and the socket thereof, and all the vessel thereof, and all
that serveth thereto, 3:37 and the pillar of the court round about,
and their sockets, and their pins, and their cords.

3:38 but those that encamp befor the tabernacl toward the east, even
befor the tabernacl of the congreg eastward, shall be moses,
and aaron and hi sons, keep the charg of the sanctuari for the
charg of the children of israel; and the stranger that cometh nigh
shal be put to death.

3:39 all that were number of the levites, which mose and aaron
numb at the command of the lord, throughout their families,
al the male from a month old and upward, were twenti and two
thousand.

3:40 and the lord said unto moses, number all the firstborn of the
mal of the children of israel from a month old and upward, and take
th number of their names.

3:41 and thou shalt take the levit for me (I am the lord) instead of
al the firstborn among the children of israel; and the cattl of the
levit instead of all the firstl among the cattl of the children
of israel.

3:42 and mose numbered, as the lord command him, all the firstborn
among the children of israel.

3:43 and all the firstborn male by the number of names, from a month
old and upward, of those that were number of them, were twenti and
two thousand two hundr and threescor and thirteen.

3:44 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 3:45 take the levites
instead of all the firstborn among the children of israel, and the
cattl of the levit instead of their cattle; and the levit shall
b mine: I am the lord.

3:46 and for those that are to be redeem of the two hundr and
threescor and thirteen of the firstborn of the children of israel,
which are more than the levites; 3:47 thou shalt even take five
shekel apiec by the poll, after the shekel of the sanctuari shalt
thou take them: (the shekel is twenti gerahs:) 3:48 and thou shalt
giv the money, wherewith the odd number of them is to be redeemed,
unto aaron and to hi sons.

3:49 and mose took the redempt money of them that were over and
abov them that were redeem by the levites: 3:50 Of the firstborn of
th children of israel took he the money; a thousand three hundr and
threescor and five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary: 3:51
and mose gave the money of them that were redeem unto aaron and to
hi sons, accord to the word of the lord, as the lord commanded
moses.

4:1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 4:2 take the
sum of the son of kohath from among the son of levi, after their
families, by the hous of their fathers, 4:3 from thirti year old and
upward even until fifti year old, all that enter into the host, to do
th work in the tabernacl of the congregation.

4:4 thi shall be the servic of the son of kohath in the tabernacle
of the congregation, about the most holi things: 4:5 and when the camp
setteth forward, aaron shall come, and hi sons, and they shall take
down the cover vail, and cover the ark of testimoni with it: 4:6
and shall put thereon the cover of badgers' skins, and shall spread
ov it a cloth wholli of blue, and shall put in the stave thereof.

4:7 and upon the tabl of shewbread they shall spread a cloth of blue,
and put thereon the dishes, and the spoons, and the bowls, and covers
to cover withal: and the continu bread shall be thereon: 4:8 and
they shall spread upon them a cloth of scarlet, and cover the same
with a cover of badgers' skins, and shall put in the staves
thereof.

4:9 and they shall take a cloth of blue, and cover the candlestick of
th light, and hi lamps, and hi tongs, and hi snuffdishes, and all
th oil vessel thereof, wherewith they minist unto it: 4:10 and
they shall put it and all the vessel thereof within a cover of
badgers' skins, and shall put it upon a bar.

4:11 and upon the golden altar they shall spread a cloth of blue, and
cov it with a cover of badgers' skins, and shall put to the
stav thereof: 4:12 and they shall take all the instrument of
ministry, wherewith they minist in the sanctuary, and put them in a
cloth of blue, and cover them with a cover of badgers' skins, and
shal put them on a bar: 4:13 and they shall take away the ash from
th altar, and spread a purpl cloth thereon: 4:14 and they shall put
upon it all the vessel thereof, wherewith they minist about it,
even the censers, the fleshhooks, and the shovels, and the basons, all
th vessel of the altar; and they shall spread upon it a cover of
badgers' skins, and put to the stave of it.

4:15 and when aaron and hi son have made an end of cover the
sanctuary, and all the vessel of the sanctuary, as the camp is to set
forward; after that, the son of kohath shall come to bear it: but
they shall not touch ani holi thing, lest they die. these thing are
th burden of the son of kohath in the tabernacl of the
congregation.

4:16 and to the offic of eleazar the son of aaron the priest
pertaineth the oil for the light, and the sweet incense, and the daily
meat offering, and the anoint oil, and the oversight of all the
tabernacle, and of all that therein is, in the sanctuary, and in the
vessel thereof.

4:17 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron saying, 4:18 cut ye
not off the tribe of the famili of the kohathit from among the
levites: 4:19 but thu do unto them, that they may live, and not die,
when they approach unto the most holi things: aaron and hi son shall
go in, and appoint them everi one to hi servic and to hi burden:
4:20 but they shall not go in to see when the holi thing are covered,
lest they die.

4:21 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 4:22 take also the sum of
th son of gershon, throughout the hous of their fathers, by their
families; 4:23 from thirti year old and upward until fifti year old
shalt thou number them; all that enter in to perform the service, to
do the work in the tabernacl of the congregation.

4:24 thi is the servic of the famili of the gershonites, to serve,
and for burdens: 4:25 and they shall bear the curtain of the
tabernacle, and the tabernacl of the congregation, hi covering, and
th cover of the badgers' skin that is abov upon it, and the
hang for the door of the tabernacl of the congregation, 4:26 and
th hang of the court, and the hang for the door of the gate of
th court, which is by the tabernacl and by the altar round about,
and their cords, and all the instrument of their service, and all
that is made for them: so shall they serve.

4:27 At the appoint of aaron and hi son shall be all the service
of the son of the gershonites, in all their burdens, and in all their
service: and ye shall appoint unto them in charg all their burdens.

4:28 thi is the servic of the famili of the son of gershon in the
tabernacl of the congregation: and their charg shall be under the
hand of ithamar the son of aaron the priest.

4:29 As for the son of merari, thou shalt number them after their
families, by the hous of their fathers; 4:30 from thirti year old
and upward even unto fifti year old shalt thou number them, everi one
that entereth into the service, to do the work of the tabernacl of
th congregation.

4:31 and thi is the charg of their burden, accord to all their
servic in the tabernacl of the congregation; the board of the
tabernacle, and the bar thereof, and the pillar thereof, and sockets
thereof, 4:32 and the pillar of the court round about, and their
sockets, and their pins, and their cords, with all their instruments,
and with all their service: and by name ye shall reckon the
instru of the charg of their burden.

4:33 thi is the servic of the famili of the son of merari,
accord to all their service, in the tabernacl of the congregation,
und the hand of ithamar the son of aaron the priest.

4:34 and mose and aaron and the chief of the congreg numbered
th son of the kohathit after their families, and after the house
of their fathers, 4:35 from thirti year old and upward even unto
fifti year old, everi one that entereth into the service, for the
work in the tabernacl of the congregation: 4:36 and those that were
numb of them by their famili were two thousand seven hundr and
fifty.

4:37 these were they that were number of the famili of the
kohathites, all that might do servic in the tabernacl of the
congregation, which mose and aaron did number accord to the
command of the lord by the hand of moses.

4:38 and those that were number of the son of gershon, throughout
their families, and by the hous of their fathers, 4:39 from thirty
year old and upward even unto fifti year old, everi one that
entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacl of the
congregation, 4:40 even those that were number of them, throughout
their families, by the hous of their fathers, were two thousand and
six hundr and thirty.

4:41 these are they that were number of the famili of the son of
gershon, of all that might do servic in the tabernacl of the
congregation, whom mose and aaron did number accord to the
command of the lord.

4:42 and those that were number of the famili of the son of
merari, throughout their families, by the hous of their fathers, 4:43
from thirti year old and upward even unto fifti year old, everi one
that entereth into the service, for the work in the tabernacl of the
congregation, 4:44 even those that were number of them after their
families, were three thousand and two hundred.

4:45 these be those that were number of the famili of the son of
merari, whom mose and aaron number accord to the word of the
lord by the hand of moses.

4:46 all those that were number of the levites, whom mose and aaron
and the chief of israel numbered, after their families, and after the
hous of their fathers, 4:47 from thirti year old and upward even
unto fifti year old, everi one that came to do the servic of the
ministry, and the servic of the burden in the tabernacl of the
congregation.

4:48 even those that were number of them, were eight thousand and
fiv hundr and fourscore, 4:49 accord to the command of the
lord they were number by the hand of moses, everi one accord to
hi service, and accord to hi burden: thu were they number of
him, as the lord command moses.

5:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 5:2 command the children of
israel, that they put out of the camp everi leper, and everi one that
hath an issue, and whosoev is defil by the dead: 5:3 both male and
femal shall ye put out, without the camp shall ye put them; that they
defil not their camps, in the midst whereof I dwell.

5:4 and the children of israel did so, and put them out without the
camp: as the lord spake unto moses, so did the children of israel.

5:5 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 5:6 speak unto the children
of israel, when a man or woman shall commit ani sin that men commit,
to do a trespass against the lord, and that person be guilty; 5:7 then
they shall confess their sin which they have done: and he shall
recompens hi trespass with the princip thereof, and add unto it
th fifth part thereof, and give it unto him against whom he hath
trespassed.

5:8 but if the man have no kinsman to recompens the trespass unto,
let the trespass be recompens unto the lord, even to the priest;
besid the ram of the atonement, wherebi an aton shall be made
for him.

5:9 and everi offer of all the holi thing of the children of
israel, which they bring unto the priest, shall be his.

5:10 and everi man' hallow thing shall be his: whatsoev ani man
giveth the priest, it shall be his.

5:11 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 5:12 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, If ani man' wife go aside, and
commit a trespass against him, 5:13 and a man lie with her carnally,
and it be hid from the eye of her husband, and be kept close, and she
b defiled, and there be no wit against her, neither she be taken
with the manner; 5:14 and the spirit of jealousi come upon him, and he
b jealou of hi wife, and she be defiled: or if the spirit of
jealousi come upon him, and he be jealou of hi wife, and she be not
defiled: 5:15 then shall the man bring hi wife unto the priest, and
h shall bring her offer for her, the tenth part of an ephah of
barley meal; he shall pour no oil upon it, nor put frankincense
thereon; for it is an offer of jealousy, an offer of memorial,
bring iniqu to remembrance.

5:16 and the priest shall bring her near, and set her befor the lord:
5:17 and the priest shall take holi water in an earthen vessel; and of
th dust that is in the floor of the tabernacl the priest shall take,
and put it into the water: 5:18 and the priest shall set the woman
befor the lord, and uncov the woman' head, and put the offer of
memori in her hands, which is the jealousi offering: and the priest
shal have in hi hand the bitter water that causeth the curse: 5:19
and the priest shall charg her by an oath, and say unto the woman, if
no man have lain with thee, and if thou hast not gone asid to
unclean with anoth instead of thi husband, be thou free from
thi bitter water that causeth the curse: 5:20 but if thou hast gone
asid to anoth instead of thi husband, and if thou be defiled, and
som man have lain with thee besid thine husband: 5:21 then the
priest shall charg the woman with an oath of cursing, and the priest
shal say unto the woman, the lord make thee a curs and an oath among
thi people, when the lord doth make thi thigh to rot, and thi belli to
swell; 5:22 and thi water that causeth the curs shall go into thy
bowels, to make thi belli to swell, and thi thigh to rot: and the
woman shall say, amen, amen.

5:23 and the priest shall write these curs in a book, and he shall
blot them out with the bitter water: 5:24 and he shall caus the woman
to drink the bitter water that causeth the curse: and the water that
causeth the curs shall enter into her, and becom bitter.

5:25 then the priest shall take the jealousi offer out of the
woman' hand, and shall wave the offer befor the lord, and offer
it upon the altar: 5:26 and the priest shall take an hand of the
offering, even the memori thereof, and burn it upon the altar, and
afterward shall caus the woman to drink the water.

5:27 and when he hath made her to drink the water, then it shall come
to pass, that, if she be defiled, and have done trespass against her
husband, that the water that causeth the curs shall enter into her,
and becom bitter, and her belli shall swell, and her thigh shall rot:
and the woman shall be a curs among her people.

5:28 and if the woman be not defiled, but be clean; then she shall be
free, and shall conceiv seed.

5:29 thi is the law of jealousies, when a wife goeth asid to another
instead of her husband, and is defiled; 5:30 Or when the spirit of
jealousi cometh upon him, and he be jealou over hi wife, and shall
set the woman befor the lord, and the priest shall execut upon her
al thi law.

5:31 then shall the man be guiltless from iniquity, and thi woman
shal bear her iniquity.

6:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:2 speak unto the children
of israel, and say unto them, when either man or woman shall separate
themselv to vow a vow of a nazarite, to separ themselv unto the
lord: 6:3 He shall separ himself from wine and strong drink, and
shal drink no vinegar of wine, or vinegar of strong drink, neither
shal he drink ani liquor of grapes, nor eat moist grapes, or dried.

6:4 all the day of hi separ shall he eat noth that is made
of the vine tree, from the kernel even to the husk.

6:5 all the day of the vow of hi separ there shall no razor
com upon hi head: until the day be fulfilled, in the which he
separateth himself unto the lord, he shall be holy, and shall let the
lock of the hair of hi head grow.

6:6 all the day that he separateth himself unto the lord he shall
com at no dead body.

6:7 He shall not make himself unclean for hi father, or for his
mother, for hi brother, or for hi sister, when they die: becaus the
consecr of hi god is upon hi head.

6:8 all the day of hi separ he is holi unto the lord.

6:9 and if ani man die veri suddenli by him, and he hath defil the
head of hi consecration; then he shall shave hi head in the day of
hi cleansing, on the seventh day shall he shave it.

6:10 and on the eighth day he shall bring two turtles, or two young
pigeons, to the priest, to the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation: 6:11 and the priest shall offer the one for a sin
offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make an atonement
for him, for that he sin by the dead, and shall hallow hi head
that same day.

6:12 and he shall consecr unto the lord the day of hi separation,
and shall bring a lamb of the first year for a trespass offering: but
th day that were befor shall be lost, becaus hi separ was
defiled.

6:13 and thi is the law of the nazarite, when the day of his
separ are fulfilled: he shall be brought unto the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation: 6:14 and he shall offer hi offering
unto the lord, one he lamb of the first year without blemish for a
burnt offering, and one ewe lamb of the first year without blemish for
a sin offering, and one ram without blemish for peac offerings, 6:15
and a basket of unleaven bread, cake of fine flour mingl with
oil, and wafer of unleaven bread anoint with oil, and their meat
offering, and their drink offerings.

6:16 and the priest shall bring them befor the lord, and shall offer
hi sin offering, and hi burnt offering: 6:17 and he shall offer the
ram for a sacrific of peac offer unto the lord, with the basket
of unleaven bread: the priest shall offer also hi meat offering,
and hi drink offering.

6:18 and the nazarit shall shave the head of hi separ at the
door of the tabernacl of the congregation, and shall take the hair of
th head of hi separation, and put it in the fire which is under the
sacrific of the peac offerings.

6:19 and the priest shall take the sodden shoulder of the ram, and one
unleaven cake out of the basket, and one unleaven wafer, and shall
put them upon the hand of the nazarite, after the hair of his
separ is shaven: 6:20 and the priest shall wave them for a wave
off befor the lord: thi is holi for the priest, with the wave
breast and heav shoulder: and after that the nazarit may drink wine.

6:21 thi is the law of the nazarit who hath vowed, and of his
off unto the lord for hi separation, besid that that hi hand
shal get: accord to the vow which he vowed, so he must do after
th law of hi separation.

6:22 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 6:23 speak unto aaron and
unto hi sons, saying, On thi wise ye shall bless the children of
israel, say unto them, 6:24 the lord bless thee, and keep thee:
6:25 the lord make hi face shine upon thee, and be graciou unto
thee: 6:26 the lord lift up hi counten upon thee, and give thee
peace.

6:27 and they shall put my name upon the children of israel, and i
wil bless them.

7:1 and it came to pass on the day that mose had fulli set up the
tabernacle, and had anoint it, and sanctifi it, and all the
instru thereof, both the altar and all the vessel thereof, and
had anoint them, and sanctifi them; 7:2 that the princ of
israel, head of the hous of their fathers, who were the princ of
th tribes, and were over them that were numbered, offered: 7:3 and
they brought their offer befor the lord, six cover wagons, and
twelv oxen; a wagon for two of the princes, and for each one an ox:
and they brought them befor the tabernacle.

7:4 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 7:5 take it of them, that
they may be to do the servic of the tabernacl of the congregation;
and thou shalt give them unto the levites, to everi man accord to
hi service.

7:6 and mose took the wagon and the oxen, and gave them unto the
levites.

7:7 two wagon and four oxen he gave unto the son of gershon,
accord to their service: 7:8 and four wagon and eight oxen he gave
unto the son of merari, accord unto their service, under the hand
of ithamar the son of aaron the priest.

7:9 but unto the son of kohath he gave none: becaus the servic of
th sanctuari belong unto them wa that they should bear upon their
shoulders.

7:10 and the princ offer for dedic of the altar in the day
that it wa anointed, even the princ offer their offer before
th altar.

7:11 and the lord said unto moses, they shall offer their offering,
each princ on hi day, for the dedic of the altar.

7:12 and he that offer hi offer the first day wa nahshon the
son of amminadab, of the tribe of judah: 7:13 and hi offer wa one
silv charger, the weight thereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels,
on silver bowl of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them were full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat
offering: 7:14 one spoon of ten shekel of gold, full of incense: 7:15
one young bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt
offering: 7:16 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:17 and for a
sacrific of peac offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five
lamb of the first year: thi wa the offer of nahshon the son of
amminadab.

7:18 On the second day nethaneel the son of zuar, princ of issachar,
did offer: 7:19 He offer for hi offer one silver charger, the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl of
seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:20 one spoon of
gold of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:21 one young bullock, one ram,
on lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:22 one kid of the
goat for a sin offering: 7:23 and for a sacrific of peac offerings,
two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first year: this
wa the offer of nethaneel the son of zuar.

7:24 On the third day eliab the son of helon, princ of the children
of zebulun, did offer: 7:25 hi offer wa one silver charger, the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl of
seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:26 one golden
spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:27 one young bullock, one
ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:28 one kid of
th goat for a sin offering: 7:29 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of eliab the son of helon.

7:30 On the fourth day elizur the son of shedeur, princ of the
children of reuben, did offer: 7:31 hi offer wa one silver
charg of the weight of an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver
bowl of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of
them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:32 one
golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:33 one young bullock,
on ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:34 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:35 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of elizur the son of shedeur.

7:36 On the fifth day shelumiel the son of zurishaddai, princ of the
children of simeon, did offer: 7:37 hi offer wa one silver
charger, the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one
silv bowl of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:38 one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:39 one young
bullock, one ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering:
7:40 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:41 and for a sacrifice
of peac offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of
th first year: thi wa the offer of shelumiel the son of
zurishaddai.

7:42 On the sixth day eliasaph the son of deuel, princ of the
children of gad, offered: 7:43 hi offer wa one silver charger of
th weight of an hundr and thirti shekels, a silver bowl of seventy
shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full of fine
flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:44 one golden spoon of
ten shekels, full of incense: 7:45 one young bullock, one ram, one
lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:46 one kid of the
goat for a sin offering: 7:47 and for a sacrific of peac offerings,
two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first year: this
wa the offer of eliasaph the son of deuel.

7:48 On the seventh day elishama the son of ammihud, princ of the
children of ephraim, offered: 7:49 hi offer wa one silver
charger, the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one
silv bowl of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:50 one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:51 one young

7:52 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:53 and for a sacrifice
of peac offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of
th first year: thi wa the offer of elishama the son of ammihud.

7:54 On the eighth day offer gamaliel the son of pedahzur, princ of
th children of manasseh: 7:55 hi offer wa one silver charger of
th weight of an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl of
seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:56 one golden
spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:57 one young bullock, one
ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:58 one kid of
th goat for a sin offering: 7:59 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of gamaliel the son of pedahzur.

7:60 On the ninth day abidan the son of gideoni, princ of the
children of benjamin, offered: 7:61 hi offer wa one silver
charger, the weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one
silv bowl of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;
both of them full of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering:
7:62 one golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:63 one young

7:64 one kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:65 and for a sacrifice
of peac offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of
th first year: thi wa the offer of abidan the son of gideoni.

7:66 On the tenth day ahiez the son of ammishaddai, princ of the
children of dan, offered: 7:67 hi offer wa one silver charger,
th weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl
of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them
ful of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:68 one
golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:69 one young bullock,
on ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:70 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:71 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of ahiez the son of ammishaddai.

7:72 On the eleventh day pagiel the son of ocran, princ of the
children of asher, offered: 7:73 hi offer wa one silver charger,
th weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl
of seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them
ful of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:74 one
golden spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:75 one young bullock,
on ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:76 one
kid of the goat for a sin offering: 7:77 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of pagiel the son of ocran.

7:78 On the twelfth day ahira the son of enan, princ of the children
of naphtali, offered: 7:79 hi offer wa one silver charger, the
weight whereof wa an hundr and thirti shekels, one silver bowl of
seventi shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary; both of them full
of fine flour mingl with oil for a meat offering: 7:80 one golden
spoon of ten shekels, full of incense: 7:81 one young bullock, one
ram, one lamb of the first year, for a burnt offering: 7:82 one kid of
th goat for a sin offering: 7:83 and for a sacrific of peace
offerings, two oxen, five rams, five he goats, five lamb of the first
year: thi wa the offer of ahira the son of enan.

7:84 thi wa the dedic of the altar, in the day when it was
anointed, by the princ of israel: twelv charger of silver, twelve
silv bowls, twelv spoon of gold: 7:85 each charger of silver
weigh an hundr and thirti shekels, each bowl seventy: all the
silv vessel weigh two thousand and four hundr shekels, after
th shekel of the sanctuary: 7:86 the golden spoon were twelve, full
of incense, weigh ten shekel apiece, after the shekel of the
sanctuary: all the gold of the spoon wa an hundr and twenty
shekels.

7:87 all the oxen for the burnt offer were twelv bullocks, the
ram twelve, the lamb of the first year twelve, with their meat
offering: and the kid of the goat for sin offer twelve.

7:88 and all the oxen for the sacrific of the peac offer were
twenti and four bullocks, the ram sixty, the he goat sixty, the
lamb of the first year sixty. thi wa the dedic of the altar,
aft that it wa anointed.

7:89 and when mose wa gone into the tabernacl of the congregation
to speak with him, then he heard the voic of one speak unto him
from off the merci seat that wa upon the ark of testimony, from
between the two cherubims: and he spake unto him.

8:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 8:2 speak unto aaron and
say unto him, when thou lightest the lamps, the seven lamp shall give
light over against the candlestick.

8:3 and aaron did so; he light the lamp thereof over against the
candlestick, as the lord command moses.

8:4 and thi work of the candlestick wa of beaten gold, unto the
shaft thereof, unto the flower thereof, wa beaten work: according
unto the pattern which the lord had shew moses, so he made the
candlestick.

8:5 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 8:6 take the levit from
among the children of israel, and cleans them.

8:7 and thu shalt thou do unto them, to cleans them: sprinkl water
of purifi upon them, and let them shave all their flesh, and let
them wash their clothes, and so make themselv clean.

8:8 then let them take a young bullock with hi meat offering, even
fin flour mingl with oil, and anoth young bullock shalt thou take
for a sin offering.

8:9 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the tabernacl of the
congregation: and thou shalt gather the whole assembl of the children
of israel together: 8:10 and thou shalt bring the levit befor the
lord: and the children of israel shall put their hand upon the
levites: 8:11 and aaron shall offer the levit befor the lord for an
off of the children of israel, that they may execut the service
of the lord.

8:12 and the levit shall lay their hand upon the head of the
bullocks: and thou shalt offer the one for a sin offering, and the
oth for a burnt offering, unto the lord, to make an aton for
th levites.

8:13 and thou shalt set the levit befor aaron, and befor hi sons,
and offer them for an offer unto the lord.

8:14 thu shalt thou separ the levit from among the children of
israel: and the levit shall be mine.

8:15 and after that shall the levit go in to do the servic of the
tabernacl of the congregation: and thou shalt cleans them, and offer
them for an offering.

8:16 for they are wholli given unto me from among the children of
israel; instead of such as open everi womb, even instead of the
firstborn of all the children of israel, have I taken them unto me.

8:17 for all the firstborn of the children of israel are mine, both
man and beast: on the day that I smote everi firstborn in the land of
egypt I sanctifi them for myself.

8:18 and I have taken the levit for all the firstborn of the
children of israel.

8:19 and I have given the levit as a gift to aaron and to hi sons
from among the children of israel, to do the servic of the children
of israel in the tabernacl of the congregation, and to make an
aton for the children of israel: that there be no plagu among
th children of israel, when the children of israel come nigh unto the
sanctuary.

8:20 and moses, and aaron, and all the congreg of the children of
israel, did to the levit accord unto all that the lord commanded
mos concern the levites, so did the children of israel unto them.

8:21 and the levit were purified, and they wash their clothes; and
aaron offer them as an offer befor the lord; and aaron made an
aton for them to cleans them.

8:22 and after that went the levit in to do their servic in the
tabernacl of the congreg befor aaron, and befor hi sons: as
th lord had command mose concern the levites, so did they unto
them.

8:23 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 8:24 thi is it that
belongeth unto the levites: from twenti and five year old and upward
they shall go in to wait upon the servic of the tabernacl of the
congregation: 8:25 and from the age of fifti year they shall cease
wait upon the servic thereof, and shall serv no more: 8:26 but
shal minist with their brethren in the tabernacl of the
congregation, to keep the charge, and shall do no service. thu shalt
thou do unto the levit touch their charge.

9:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the wilder of sinai, in the
first month of the second year after they were come out of the land of
egypt, saying, 9:2 let the children of israel also keep the passover
at hi appoint season.

9:3 In the fourteenth day of thi month, at even, ye shall keep it in
hi appoint season: accord to all the rite of it, and according
to all the ceremoni thereof, shall ye keep it.

9:4 and mose spake unto the children of israel, that they should keep
th passover.

9:5 and they kept the passov on the fourteenth day of the first
month at even in the wilder of sinai: accord to all that the
lord command moses, so did the children of israel.

9:6 and there were certain men, who were defil by the dead bodi of a
man, that they could not keep the passov on that day: and they came
befor mose and befor aaron on that day: 9:7 and those men said unto
him, We are defil by the dead bodi of a man: wherefor are we kept
back, that we may not offer an offer of the lord in hi appointed
season among the children of israel?  9:8 and mose said unto them,
stand still, and I will hear what the lord will command concerning
you.

9:9 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 9:10 speak unto the
children of israel, saying, If ani man of you or of your posterity
shal be unclean by reason of a dead body, or be in a journey afar
off, yet he shall keep the passov unto the lord.

9:11 the fourteenth day of the second month at even they shall keep
it, and eat it with unleaven bread and bitter herbs.

9:12 they shall leav none of it unto the morning, nor break ani bone
of it: accord to all the ordin of the passov they shall keep
it.

9:13 but the man that is clean, and is not in a journey, and
forbeareth to keep the passover, even the same soul shall be cut off
from among hi people: becaus he brought not the offer of the lord
in hi appoint season, that man shall bear hi sin.

9:14 and if a stranger shall sojourn among you, and will keep the
passov unto the lord; accord to the ordin of the passover,
and accord to the manner thereof, so shall he do: ye shall have one
ordinance, both for the stranger, and for him that wa born in the
land.

9:15 and on the day that the tabernacl wa rear up the cloud
cov the tabernacle, namely, the tent of the testimony: and at even
ther wa upon the tabernacl as it were the appear of fire, until
th morning.

9:16 So it wa alway: the cloud cover it by day, and the appearance
of fire by night.

9:17 and when the cloud wa taken up from the tabernacle, then after
that the children of israel journeyed: and in the place where the
cloud abode, there the children of israel pitch their tents.

9:18 At the command of the lord the children of israel journeyed,
and at the command of the lord they pitched: as long as the cloud
abod upon the tabernacl they rest in their tents.

9:19 and when the cloud tarri long upon the tabernacl mani days,
then the children of israel kept the charg of the lord, and journeyed
not.

9:20 and so it was, when the cloud wa a few day upon the tabernacle;
accord to the command of the lord they abod in their tents,
and accord to the command of the lord they journeyed.

9:21 and so it was, when the cloud abod from even unto the morning,
and that the cloud wa taken up in the morning, then they journeyed:
wheth it wa by day or by night that the cloud wa taken up, they
journeyed.

9:22 Or whether it were two days, or a month, or a year, that the
cloud tarri upon the tabernacle, remain thereon, the children of
israel abod in their tents, and journey not: but when it wa taken
up, they journeyed.

9:23 At the command of the lord they rest in the tents, and at
th command of the lord they journeyed: they kept the charg of
th lord, at the command of the lord by the hand of moses.

10:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 10:2 make thee two
trumpet of silver; of a whole piec shalt thou make them: that thou
mayest use them for the call of the assembly, and for the
journey of the camps.

10:3 and when they shall blow with them, all the assembl shall
assembl themselv to thee at the door of the tabernacl of the
congregation.

10:4 and if they blow but with one trumpet, then the princes, which
ar head of the thousand of israel, shall gather themselv unto
thee.

10:5 when ye blow an alarm, then the camp that lie on the east parts
shal go forward.

10:6 when ye blow an alarm the second time, then the camp that lie on
th south side shall take their journey: they shall blow an alarm for
their journeys.

10:7 but when the congreg is to be gather together, ye shall
blow, but ye shall not sound an alarm.

10:8 and the son of aaron, the priests, shall blow with the trumpets;
and they shall be to you for an ordin for ever throughout your
generations.

10:9 and if ye go to war in your land against the enemi that
oppresseth you, then ye shall blow an alarm with the trumpets; and ye
shal be rememb befor the lord your god, and ye shall be saved
from your enemies.

10:10 also in the day of your gladness, and in your solemn days, and
in the begin of your months, ye shall blow with the trumpet over
your burnt offerings, and over the sacrific of your peac offerings;
that they may be to you for a memori befor your god: I am the lord
your god.

10:11 and it came to pass on the twentieth day of the second month, in
th second year, that the cloud wa taken up from off the tabernacle
of the testimony.

10:12 and the children of israel took their journey out of the
wild of sinai; and the cloud rest in the wilder of paran.

10:13 and they first took their journey accord to the commandment
of the lord by the hand of moses.

10:14 In the first place went the standard of the camp of the children
of judah accord to their armies: and over hi host wa nahshon the
son of amminadab.

10:15 and over the host of the tribe of the children of issachar was
nethaneel the son of zuar.

10:16 and over the host of the tribe of the children of zebulun was
eliab the son of helon.

10:17 and the tabernacl wa taken down; and the son of gershon and
th son of merari set forward, bear the tabernacle.

10:18 and the standard of the camp of reuben set forward accord to
their armies: and over hi host wa elizur the son of shedeur.

10:19 and over the host of the tribe of the children of simeon was
shelumiel the son of zurishaddai.

10:20 and over the host of the tribe of the children of gad was
eliasaph the son of deuel.

10:21 and the kohathit set forward, bear the sanctuary: and the
oth did set up the tabernacl against they came.

10:22 and the standard of the camp of the children of ephraim set
forward accord to their armies: and over hi host wa elishama the
son of ammihud.

10:23 and over the host of the tribe of the children of manasseh was
gamaliel the son of pedahzur.

10:24 and over the host of the tribe of the children of benjamin was
abidan the son of gideoni.

10:25 and the standard of the camp of the children of dan set forward,
which wa the rereward of all the camp throughout their hosts: and
ov hi host wa ahiez the son of ammishaddai.

10:26 and over the host of the tribe of the children of asher was
pagiel the son of ocran.

10:27 and over the host of the tribe of the children of naphtali was
ahira the son of enan.

10:28 thu were the journey of the children of israel accord to
their armies, when they set forward.

10:29 and mose said unto hobab, the son of raguel the midianite,
moses' father in law, We are journey unto the place of which the
lord said, I will give it you: come thou with us, and we will do thee
good: for the lord hath spoken good concern israel.

10:30 and he said unto him, I will not go; but I will depart to mine
own land, and to my kindred.

10:31 and he said, leav us not, I pray thee; forasmuch as thou
knowest how we are to encamp in the wilderness, and thou mayest be to
u instead of eyes.

10:32 and it shall be, if thou go with us, yea, it shall be, that what
good the lord shall do unto us, the same will we do unto thee.

10:33 and they depart from the mount of the lord three days'
journey: and the ark of the coven of the lord went befor them in
th three days' journey, to search out a rest place for them.

10:34 and the cloud of the lord wa upon them by day, when they went
out of the camp.

10:35 and it came to pass, when the ark set forward, that mose said,
ris up, lord, and let thine enemi be scattered; and let them that
hat thee flee befor thee.

10:36 and when it rested, he said, return, O lord, unto the many
thousand of israel.

11:1 and when the peopl complained, it displeas the lord: and the
lord heard it; and hi anger wa kindled; and the fire of the lord
burnt among them, and consum them that were in the uttermost parts
of the camp.

11:2 and the peopl cri unto moses; and when mose pray unto the
lord, the fire wa quenched.

11:3 and he call the name of the place taberah: becaus the fire of
th lord burnt among them.

11:4 and the mixt multitud that wa among them fell a lusting: and
th children of israel also wept again, and said, who shall give us
flesh to eat?  11:5 We rememb the fish, which we did eat in egypt
freely; the cucumbers, and the melons, and the leeks, and the onions,
and the garlick: 11:6 but now our soul is dri away: there is nothing
at all, besid thi manna, befor our eyes.

11:7 and the manna wa as coriand seed, and the colour thereof as
th colour of bdellium.

11:8 and the peopl went about, and gather it, and ground it in
mills, or beat it in a mortar, and bake it in pans, and made cake of
it: and the tast of it wa as the tast of fresh oil.

11:9 and when the dew fell upon the camp in the night, the manna fell
upon it.

11:10 then mose heard the peopl weep throughout their families,
everi man in the door of hi tent: and the anger of the lord was
kindl greatly; mose also wa displeased.

11:11 and mose said unto the lord, wherefor hast thou afflict thy
servant? and wherefor have I not found favour in thi sight, that thou
layest the burden of all thi peopl upon me?  11:12 have I conceived
al thi people? have I begotten them, that thou shouldest say unto
