me, carri them in thi bosom, as a nurs father beareth the sucking
child, unto the land which thou swarest unto their fathers?  11:13
whenc should I have flesh to give unto all thi people? for they weep
unto me, saying, give us flesh, that we may eat.

11:14 I am not abl to bear all thi peopl alone, becaus it is too
heavi for me.

11:15 and if thou deal thu with me, kill me, I pray thee, out of
hand, if I have found favour in thi sight; and let me not see my
wretchedness.

11:16 and the lord said unto moses, gather unto me seventi men of the
eld of israel, whom thou knowest to be the elder of the people,
and offic over them; and bring them unto the tabernacl of the
congregation, that they may stand there with thee.

11:17 and I will come down and talk with thee there: and I will take
of the spirit which is upon thee, and will put it upon them; and they
shal bear the burden of the peopl with thee, that thou bear it not
thyself alone.

11:18 and say thou unto the people, sanctifi yourselv against to
morrow, and ye shall eat flesh: for ye have wept in the ear of the
lord, saying, who shall give us flesh to eat? for it wa well with us
in egypt: therefor the lord will give you flesh, and ye shall eat.

11:19 Ye shall not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither
ten days, nor twenti days; 11:20 but even a whole month, until it come
out at your nostrils, and it be loathsom unto you: becaus that ye
hav despis the lord which is among you, and have wept befor him,
saying, whi came we forth out of egypt?  11:21 and mose said, the
people, among whom I am, are six hundr thousand footmen; and thou
hast said, I will give them flesh, that they may eat a whole month.

11:22 shall the flock and the herd be slain for them, to suffice
them?  or shall all the fish of the sea be gather togeth for them,
to suffic them?  11:23 and the lord said unto moses, Is the lord's
hand wax short? thou shalt see now whether my word shall come to
pass unto thee or not.

11:24 and mose went out, and told the peopl the word of the lord,
and gather the seventi men of the elder of the people, and set them
round about the tabernacle.

11:25 and the lord came down in a cloud, and spake unto him, and took
of the spirit that wa upon him, and gave it unto the seventi elders:
and it came to pass, that, when the spirit rest upon them, they
prophesied, and did not cease.

11:26 but there remain two of the men in the camp, the name of the
on wa eldad, and the name of the other medad: and the spirit rested
upon them; and they were of them that were written, but went not out
unto the tabernacle: and they prophesi in the camp.

11:27 and there ran a young man, and told moses, and said, eldad and
medad do prophesi in the camp.

11:28 and joshua the son of nun, the servant of moses, one of his
young men, answer and said, My lord moses, forbid them.

11:29 and mose said unto him, enviest thou for my sake? would god
that all the lord' peopl were prophets, and that the lord would put
hi spirit upon them!  11:30 and mose gat him into the camp, he and
th elder of israel.

11:31 and there went forth a wind from the lord, and brought quails
from the sea, and let them fall by the camp, as it were a day's
journey on thi side, and as it were a day' journey on the other
side, round about the camp, and as it were two cubit high upon the
fac of the earth.

11:32 and the peopl stood up all that day, and all that night, and
al the next day, and they gather the quails: he that gather least
gath ten homers: and they spread them all abroad for themselves
round about the camp.

11:33 and while the flesh wa yet between their teeth, ere it was
chewed, the wrath of the lord wa kindl against the people, and the
lord smote the peopl with a veri great plague.

11:34 and he call the name of that place kibrothhattaavah: because
ther they buri the peopl that lusted.

11:35 and the peopl journey from kibrothhattaavah unto hazeroth;
and abod at hazeroth.

12:1 and miriam and aaron spake against mose becaus of the ethiopian
woman whom he had married: for he had marri an ethiopian woman.

12:2 and they said, hath the lord inde spoken onli by moses? hath he
not spoken also by us? and the lord heard it.

12:3 (now the man mose wa veri meek, abov all the men which were
upon the face of the earth.)  12:4 and the lord spake suddenli unto
moses, and unto aaron, and unto miriam, come out ye three unto the
tabernacl of the congregation. and they three came out.

12:5 and the lord came down in the pillar of the cloud, and stood in
th door of the tabernacle, and call aaron and miriam: and they both
cam forth.

12:6 and he said, hear now my words: If there be a prophet among you,
i the lord will make myself known unto him in a vision, and will speak
unto him in a dream.

12:7 My servant mose is not so, who is faith in all mine house.

12:8 with him will I speak mouth to mouth, even apparently, and not in
dark speeches; and the similitud of the lord shall he behold:
wherefor then were ye not afraid to speak against my servant moses?
12:9 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against them; and he
departed.

12:10 and the cloud depart from off the tabernacle; and, behold,
miriam becam leprous, white as snow: and aaron look upon miriam,
and, behold, she wa leprous.

12:11 and aaron said unto moses, alas, my lord, I beseech thee, lay
not the sin upon us, wherein we have done foolishly, and wherein we
hav sinned.

12:12 let her not be as one dead, of whom the flesh is half consumed
when he cometh out of hi mother' womb.

12:13 and mose cri unto the lord, saying, heal her now, O god, i
beseech thee.

12:14 and the lord said unto moses, If her father had but spit in her
face, should she not be asham seven days? let her be shut out from
th camp seven days, and after that let her be receiv in again.

12:15 and miriam wa shut out from the camp seven days: and the people
journey not till miriam wa brought in again.

12:16 and afterward the peopl remov from hazeroth, and pitch in
th wilder of paran.

13:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 13:2 send thou men, that
they may search the land of canaan, which I give unto the children of
israel: of everi tribe of their father shall ye send a man, everi one
a ruler among them.

13:3 and mose by the command of the lord sent them from the
wild of paran: all those men were head of the children of
israel.

13:4 and these were their names: of the tribe of reuben, shammua the
son of zaccur.

13:5 Of the tribe of simeon, shaphat the son of hori.

13:6 Of the tribe of judah, caleb the son of jephunneh.

13:7 Of the tribe of issachar, igal the son of joseph.

13:8 Of the tribe of ephraim, oshea the son of nun.

13:9 Of the tribe of benjamin, palti the son of raphu.

13:10 Of the tribe of zebulun, gaddiel the son of sodi.

13:11 Of the tribe of joseph, namely, of the tribe of manasseh, gaddi
th son of susi.

13:12 Of the tribe of dan, ammiel the son of gemalli.

13:13 Of the tribe of asher, sethur the son of michael.

13:14 Of the tribe of naphtali, nahbi the son of vophsi.

13:15 Of the tribe of gad, geuel the son of machi.

13:16 these are the name of the men which mose sent to spi out the
land.

and mose call oshea the son of nun jehoshua.

13:17 and mose sent them to spi out the land of canaan, and said unto
them, get you up thi way southward, and go up into the mountain:
13:18 and see the land, what it is, and the peopl that dwelleth
therein, whether they be strong or weak, few or many; 13:19 and what
th land is that they dwell in, whether it be good or bad; and what
citi they be that they dwell in, whether in tents, or in strong
holds; 13:20 and what the land is, whether it be fat or lean, whether
ther be wood therein, or not. and be ye of good courage, and bring of
th fruit of the land. now the time wa the time of the firstripe
grapes.

13:21 So they went up, and search the land from the wilder of
zin unto rehob, as men come to hamath.

13:22 and they ascend by the south, and came unto hebron; where
ahiman, sheshai, and talmai, the children of anak, were. (now hebron
wa built seven year befor zoan in egypt.)  13:23 and they came unto
th brook of eshcol, and cut down from thenc a branch with one
clust of grapes, and they bare it between two upon a staff; and they
brought of the pomegranates, and of the figs.

13:24 the place wa call the brook eshcol, becaus of the cluster of
grap which the children of israel cut down from thence.

13:25 and they return from search of the land after forti days.

13:26 and they went and came to moses, and to aaron, and to all the
congreg of the children of israel, unto the wilder of paran,
to kadesh; and brought back word unto them, and unto all the
congregation, and shew them the fruit of the land.

13:27 and they told him, and said, We came unto the land whither thou
sentest us, and sure it floweth with milk and honey; and thi is the
fruit of it.

13:28 nevertheless the peopl be strong that dwell in the land, and
th citi are walled, and veri great: and moreov we saw the
children of anak there.

13:29 the amalekit dwell in the land of the south: and the hittites,
and the jebusites, and the amorites, dwell in the mountains: and the
canaanit dwell by the sea, and by the coast of jordan.

13:30 and caleb still the peopl befor moses, and said, let us go
up at once, and possess it; for we are well abl to overcom it.

13:31 but the men that went up with him said, We be not abl to go up
against the people; for they are stronger than we.

13:32 and they brought up an evil report of the land which they had
search unto the children of israel, saying, the land, through which
w have gone to search it, is a land that eateth up the inhabitants
thereof; and all the peopl that we saw in it are men of a great
stature.

13:33 and there we saw the giants, the son of anak, which come of the
giants: and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were
in their sight.

14:1 and all the congreg lift up their voice, and cried; and
th peopl wept that night.

14:2 and all the children of israel murmur against mose and against
aaron: and the whole congreg said unto them, would god that we
had die in the land of egypt! or would god we had die in this
wilderness!  14:3 and wherefor hath the lord brought us unto this
land, to fall by the sword, that our wive and our children should be
a prey? were it not better for us to return into egypt?  14:4 and they
said one to another, let us make a captain, and let us return into
egypt.

14:5 then mose and aaron fell on their face befor all the assembly
of the congreg of the children of israel.

14:6 and joshua the son of nun, and caleb the son of jephunneh, which
wer of them that search the land, rent their clothes: 14:7 and they
spak unto all the compani of the children of israel, saying, the
land, which we pass through to search it, is an exceed good land.

14:8 If the lord delight in us, then he will bring us into thi land,
and give it us; a land which floweth with milk and honey.

14:9 onli rebel not ye against the lord, neither fear ye the peopl of
th land; for they are bread for us: their defenc is depart from
them, and the lord is with us: fear them not.

14:10 but all the congreg bade stone them with stones. and the
glori of the lord appear in the tabernacl of the congregation
befor all the children of israel.

14:11 and the lord said unto moses, how long will thi peopl provoke
me?  and how long will it be ere they believ me, for all the signs
which I have shew among them?  14:12 I will smite them with the
pestilence, and disinherit them, and will make of thee a greater
n and mightier than they.

14:13 and mose said unto the lord, then the egyptian shall hear it,
(for thou broughtest up thi peopl in thi might from among them;)
14:14 and they will tell it to the inhabit of thi land: for they
hav heard that thou lord art among thi people, that thou lord art
seen face to face, and that thi cloud standeth over them, and that
thou goest befor them, by day time in a pillar of a cloud, and in a
pillar of fire by night.

14:15 now if thou shalt kill all thi peopl as one man, then the
nat which have heard the fame of thee will speak, saying, 14:16
becaus the lord wa not abl to bring thi peopl into the land which
h sware unto them, therefor he hath slain them in the wilderness.

14:17 and now, I beseech thee, let the power of my lord be great,
accord as thou hast spoken, saying, 14:18 the lord is
longsuffering, and of great mercy, forgiv iniqu and
transgression, and by no mean clear the guilty, visit the
iniqu of the father upon the children unto the third and fourth
generation.

14:19 pardon, I beseech thee, the iniqu of thi peopl according
unto the great of thi mercy, and as thou hast forgiven this
people, from egypt even until now.

14:20 and the lord said, I have pardon accord to thi word: 14:21
but as truli as I live, all the earth shall be fill with the glory
of the lord.

14:22 becaus all those men which have seen my glory, and my miracles,
which I did in egypt and in the wilderness, and have tempt me now
thes ten times, and have not hearken to my voice; 14:23 sure they
shal not see the land which I sware unto their fathers, neither shall
ani of them that provok me see it: 14:24 but my servant caleb,
becaus he had anoth spirit with him, and hath follow me fully,
him will I bring into the land whereinto he went; and hi seed shall
possess it.

14:25 (now the amalekit and the canaanit dwelt in the valley.)
tomorrow turn you, and get you into the wilder by the way of the
r sea.

14:26 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 14:27 how
long shall I bear with thi evil congregation, which murmur against
me? I have heard the murmur of the children of israel, which they
murmur against me.

14:28 say unto them, As truli as I live, saith the lord, as ye have
spoken in mine ears, so will I do to you: 14:29 your carcas shall
fal in thi wilderness; and all that were number of you, according
to your whole number, from twenti year old and upward which have
murmur against me.

14:30 doubtless ye shall not come into the land, concern which i
swar to make you dwell therein, save caleb the son of jephunneh, and
joshua the son of nun.

14:31 but your littl ones, which ye said should be a prey, them will
i bring in, and they shall know the land which ye have despised.

14:32 but as for you, your carcases, they shall fall in this
wilderness.

14:33 and your children shall wander in the wilder forti years,
and bear your whoredoms, until your carcas be wast in the
wilderness.

14:34 after the number of the day in which ye search the land, even
forti days, each day for a year, shall ye bear your iniquities, even
forti years, and ye shall know my breach of promise.

14:35 I the lord have said, I will sure do it unto all thi evil
congregation, that are gather togeth against me: in this
wild they shall be consumed, and there they shall die.

14:36 and the men, which mose sent to search the land, who returned,
and made all the congreg to murmur against him, by bring up a
sland upon the land, 14:37 even those men that did bring up the evil
report upon the land, die by the plagu befor the lord.

14:38 but joshua the son of nun, and caleb the son of jephunneh, which
wer of the men that went to search the land, live still.

14:39 and mose told these say unto all the children of israel:
and the peopl mourn greatly.

14:40 and they rose up earli in the morning, and gat them up into the
top of the mountain, saying, lo, we be here, and will go up unto the
plac which the lord hath promised: for we have sinned.

14:41 and mose said, wherefor now do ye transgress the commandment
of the lord? but it shall not prosper.

14:42 Go not up, for the lord is not among you; that ye be not smitten
befor your enemies.

14:43 for the amalekit and the canaanit are there befor you, and
y shall fall by the sword: becaus ye are turn away from the lord,
therefor the lord will not be with you.

14:44 but they presum to go up unto the hill top: nevertheless the
ark of the coven of the lord, and moses, depart not out of the
camp.

14:45 then the amalekit came down, and the canaanit which dwelt in
that hill, and smote them, and discomfit them, even unto hormah.

15:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 15:2 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, when ye be come into the land
of your habitations, which I give unto you, 15:3 and will make an
off by fire unto the lord, a burnt offering, or a sacrific in
perform a vow, or in a freewil offering, or in your solemn feasts,
to make a sweet savour unto the lord, of the herd or of the flock:
15:4 then shall he that offereth hi offer unto the lord bring a
meat offer of a tenth deal of flour mingl with the fourth part of
an hin of oil.

15:5 and the fourth part of an hin of wine for a drink offer shalt
thou prepar with the burnt offer or sacrifice, for one lamb.

15:6 Or for a ram, thou shalt prepar for a meat offer two tenth
deal of flour mingl with the third part of an hin of oil.

15:7 and for a drink offer thou shalt offer the third part of an
hin of wine, for a sweet savour unto the lord.

15:8 and when thou preparest a bullock for a burnt offering, or for a
sacrific in perform a vow, or peac offer unto the lord: 15:9
then shall he bring with a bullock a meat offer of three tenth
deal of flour mingl with half an hin of oil.

15:10 and thou shalt bring for a drink offer half an hin of wine,
for an offer made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord.

15:11 thu shall it be done for one bullock, or for one ram, or for a
lamb, or a kid.

15:12 accord to the number that ye shall prepare, so shall ye do to
everi one accord to their number.

15:13 all that are born of the countri shall do these thing after
thi manner, in offer an offer made by fire, of a sweet savour
unto the lord.

15:14 and if a stranger sojourn with you, or whosoev be among you in
your generations, and will offer an offer made by fire, of a sweet
savour unto the lord; as ye do, so he shall do.

15:15 one ordin shall be both for you of the congregation, and
also for the stranger that sojourneth with you, an ordin for ever
in your generations: as ye are, so shall the stranger be befor the
lord.

15:16 one law and one manner shall be for you, and for the stranger
that sojourneth with you.

15:17 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 15:18 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, when ye come into the land
whith I bring you, 15:19 then it shall be, that, when ye eat of the
bread of the land, ye shall offer up an heav offer unto the lord.

15:20 Ye shall offer up a cake of the first of your dough for an heave
offering: as ye do the heav offer of the threshingfloor, so shall
y heav it.

15:21 Of the first of your dough ye shall give unto the lord an heave
off in your generations.

15:22 and if ye have erred, and not observ all these commandments,
which the lord hath spoken unto moses, 15:23 even all that the lord
hath command you by the hand of moses, from the day that the lord
command moses, and henceforward among your generations; 15:24 then
it shall be, if ought be commit by ignor without the knowledge
of the congregation, that all the congreg shall offer one young
bullock for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour unto the lord, with
hi meat offering, and hi drink offering, accord to the manner,
and one kid of the goat for a sin offering.

15:25 and the priest shall make an aton for all the congregation
of the children of israel, and it shall be forgiven them; for it is
ignorance: and they shall bring their offering, a sacrific made by
fir unto the lord, and their sin offer befor the lord, for their
ignorance: 15:26 and it shall be forgiven all the congreg of the
children of israel, and the stranger that sojourneth among them;
se all the peopl were in ignorance.

15:27 and if ani soul sin through ignorance, then he shall bring a she
goat of the first year for a sin offering.

15:28 and the priest shall make an aton for the soul that sinneth
ignorantly, when he sinneth by ignor befor the lord, to make an
aton for him; and it shall be forgiven him.

15:29 Ye shall have one law for him that sinneth through ignorance,
both for him that is born among the children of israel, and for the
strang that sojourneth among them.

15:30 but the soul that doeth ought presumptuously, whether he be born
in the land, or a stranger, the same reproacheth the lord; and that
soul shall be cut off from among hi people.

15:31 becaus he hath despis the word of the lord, and hath broken
hi commandment, that soul shall utterli be cut off; hi iniquity
shal be upon him.

15:32 and while the children of israel were in the wilderness, they
found a man that gather stick upon the sabbath day.

15:33 and they that found him gather stick brought him unto moses
and aaron, and unto all the congregation.

15:34 and they put him in ward, becaus it wa not declar what
should be done to him.

15:35 and the lord said unto moses, the man shall be sure put to
death: all the congreg shall stone him with stone without the
camp.

15:36 and all the congreg brought him without the camp, and
ston him with stones, and he died; as the lord command moses.

15:37 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 15:38 speak unto the
children of israel, and bid them that they make them fring in the
bord of their garment throughout their generations, and that they
put upon the fring of the border a ribband of blue: 15:39 and it
shal be unto you for a fringe, that ye may look upon it, and remember
al the command of the lord, and do them; and that ye seek not
aft your own heart and your own eyes, after which ye use to go a
whoring: 15:40 that ye may remember, and do all my commandments, and
b holi unto your god.

15:41 I am the lord your god, which brought you out of the land of
egypt, to be your god: I am the lord your god.

16:1 now korah, the son of izhar, the son of kohath, the son of levi,
and dathan and abiram, the son of eliab, and on, the son of peleth,
son of reuben, took men: 16:2 and they rose up befor moses, with
certain of the children of israel, two hundr and fifti princ of
th assembly, famou in the congregation, men of renown: 16:3 and they
gath themselv togeth against mose and against aaron, and said
unto them, Ye take too much upon you, see all the congreg are
holy, everi one of them, and the lord is among them: wherefor then
lift ye up yourselv abov the congreg of the lord?  16:4 and
when mose heard it, he fell upon hi face: 16:5 and he spake unto
korah and unto all hi company, saying, even to morrow the lord will
shew who are his, and who is holy; and will caus him to come near
unto him: even him whom he hath chosen will he caus to come near unto
him.

16:6 thi do; take you censers, korah, and all hi company; 16:7 and
put fire therein, and put incens in them befor the lord to morrow:
and it shall be that the man whom the lord doth choose, he shall be
holy: ye take too much upon you, ye son of levi.

16:8 and mose said unto korah, hear, I pray you, ye son of levi:
16:9 seemeth it but a small thing unto you, that the god of israel
hath separ you from the congreg of israel, to bring you near
to himself to do the servic of the tabernacl of the lord, and to
stand befor the congreg to minist unto them?  16:10 and he
hath brought thee near to him, and all thi brethren the son of levi
with thee: and seek ye the priesthood also?  16:11 for which cause
both thou and all thi compani are gather togeth against the lord:
and what is aaron, that ye murmur against him?  16:12 and mose sent
to call dathan and abiram, the son of eliab: which said, We will not
com up: 16:13 Is it a small thing that thou hast brought us up out of
a land that floweth with milk and honey, to kill us in the wilderness,
except thou make thyself altogeth a princ over us?  16:14 moreover
th hast not brought us into a land that floweth with milk and honey,
or given us inherit of field and vineyards: wilt thou put out the
ey of these men? we will not come up.

16:15 and mose wa veri wroth, and said unto the lord, respect not
thou their offering: I have not taken one ass from them, neither have
i hurt one of them.

16:16 and mose said unto korah, Be thou and all thi compani before
th lord, thou, and they, and aaron, to morrow: 16:17 and take every
man hi censer, and put incens in them, and bring ye befor the lord
everi man hi censer, two hundr and fifti censers; thou also, and
aaron, each of you hi censer.

16:18 and they took everi man hi censer, and put fire in them, and
laid incens thereon, and stood in the door of the tabernacl of the
congreg with mose and aaron.

16:19 and korah gather all the congreg against them unto the
door of the tabernacl of the congregation: and the glori of the lord
appear unto all the congregation.

16:20 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 16:21
separ yourselv from among thi congregation, that I may consume
them in a moment.

16:22 and they fell upon their faces, and said, O god, the god of the
spirit of all flesh, shall one man sin, and wilt thou be wroth with
al the congregation?  16:23 and the lord spake unto moses, saying,
16:24 speak unto the congregation, saying, get you up from about the
tabernacl of korah, dathan, and abiram.

16:25 and mose rose up and went unto dathan and abiram; and the
eld of israel follow him.

16:26 and he spake unto the congregation, saying, depart, I pray you,
from the tent of these wick men, and touch noth of their's, lest
y be consum in all their sins.

16:27 So they gat up from the tabernacl of korah, dathan, and abiram,
on everi side: and dathan and abiram came out, and stood in the door
of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little
children.

16:28 and mose said, herebi ye shall know that the lord hath sent me
to do all these works; for I have not done them of mine own mind.

16:29 If these men die the common death of all men, or if they be
visit after the visit of all men; then the lord hath not sent
me.

16:30 but if the lord make a new thing, and the earth open her mouth,
and swallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go
down quick into the pit; then ye shall understand that these men have
provok the lord.

16:31 and it came to pass, as he had made an end of speak all these
words, that the ground clave asund that wa under them: 16:32 and
th earth open her mouth, and swallow them up, and their houses,
and all the men that appertain unto korah, and all their goods.

16:33 they, and all that appertain to them, went down aliv into the
pit, and the earth close upon them: and they perish from among the
congregation.

16:34 and all israel that were round about them fled at the cri of
them: for they said, lest the earth swallow us up also.

16:35 and there came out a fire from the lord, and consum the two
hundr and fifti men that offer incense.

16:36 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 16:37 speak unto eleazar
th son of aaron the priest, that he take up the censer out of the
burning, and scatter thou the fire yonder; for they are hallowed.

16:38 the censer of these sinner against their own souls, let them
mak them broad plate for a cover of the altar: for they offered
them befor the lord, therefor they are hallowed: and they shall be a
sign unto the children of israel.

16:39 and eleazar the priest took the brasen censers, wherewith they
that were burnt had offered; and they were made broad plate for a
cov of the altar: 16:40 To be a memori unto the children of
israel, that no stranger, which is not of the seed of aaron, come near
to offer incens befor the lord; that he be not as korah, and as his
company: as the lord said to him by the hand of moses.

16:41 but on the morrow all the congreg of the children of israel
murmur against mose and against aaron, saying, Ye have kill the
peopl of the lord.

16:42 and it came to pass, when the congreg wa gather against
mos and against aaron, that they look toward the tabernacl of the
congregation: and, behold, the cloud cover it, and the glori of the
lord appeared.

16:43 and mose and aaron came befor the tabernacl of the
congregation.

16:44 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 16:45 get you up from
among thi congregation, that I may consum them as in a moment. and
they fell upon their faces.

16:46 and mose said unto aaron, take a censer, and put fire therein
from off the altar, and put on incense, and go quickli unto the
congregation, and make an aton for them: for there is wrath gone
out from the lord; the plagu is begun.

16:47 and aaron took as mose commanded, and ran into the midst of the
congregation; and, behold, the plagu wa begun among the people: and
h put on incense, and made an aton for the people.

16:48 and he stood between the dead and the living; and the plagu was
stayed.

16:49 now they that die in the plagu were fourteen thousand and
seven hundred, besid them that die about the matter of korah.

16:50 and aaron return unto mose unto the door of the tabernacl of
th congregation: and the plagu wa stayed.

17:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 17:2 speak unto the
children of israel, and take of everi one of them a rod accord to
th hous of their fathers, of all their princ accord to the
hous of their father twelv rods: write thou everi man' name upon
hi rod.

17:3 and thou shalt write aaron' name upon the rod of levi: for one
rod shall be for the head of the hous of their fathers.

17:4 and thou shalt lay them up in the tabernacl of the congregation
befor the testimony, where I will meet with you.

17:5 and it shall come to pass, that the man' rod, whom I shall
choose, shall blossom: and I will make to ceas from me the murmurings
of the children of israel, wherebi they murmur against you.

17:6 and mose spake unto the children of israel, and everi one of
their princ gave him a rod apiece, for each princ one, accord to
their fathers' houses, even twelv rods: and the rod of aaron was
among their rods.

17:7 and mose laid up the rod befor the lord in the tabernacl of
witness.

17:8 and it came to pass, that on the morrow mose went into the
tabernacl of witness; and, behold, the rod of aaron for the hous of
levi wa budded, and brought forth buds, and bloom blossoms, and
yield almonds.

17:9 and mose brought out all the rod from befor the lord unto all
th children of israel: and they looked, and took everi man hi rod.

17:10 and the lord said unto moses, bring aaron' rod again befor the
testimony, to be kept for a token against the rebels; and thou shalt
quit take away their murmur from me, that they die not.

17:11 and mose did so: as the lord command him, so did he.

17:12 and the children of israel spake unto moses, saying, behold, we
die, we perish, we all perish.

17:13 whosoev cometh ani thing near unto the tabernacl of the lord
shal die: shall we be consum with dying?  18:1 and the lord said
unto aaron, thou and thi son and thi father' hous with thee shall
bear the iniqu of the sanctuary: and thou and thi son with thee
shal bear the iniqu of your priesthood.

18:2 and thi brethren also of the tribe of levi, the tribe of thy
father, bring thou with thee, that they may be join unto thee, and
minist unto thee: but thou and thi son with thee shall minister
befor the tabernacl of witness.

18:3 and they shall keep thi charge, and the charg of all the
tabernacle: onli they shall not come nigh the vessel of the sanctuary
and the altar, that neither they, nor ye also, die.

18:4 and they shall be join unto thee, and keep the charg of the
tabernacl of the congregation, for all the servic of the tabernacle:
and a stranger shall not come nigh unto you.

18:5 and ye shall keep the charg of the sanctuary, and the charg of
th altar: that there be no wrath ani more upon the children of
israel.

18:6 and I, behold, I have taken your brethren the levit from among
th children of israel: to you they are given as a gift for the lord,
to do the servic of the tabernacl of the congregation.

18:7 therefor thou and thi son with thee shall keep your priest's
offic for everyth of the altar, and within the vail; and ye shall
serve: I have given your priest' offic unto you as a servic of
gift: and the stranger that cometh nigh shall be put to death.

18:8 and the lord spake unto aaron, behold, I also have given thee the
charg of mine heav offer of all the hallow thing of the
children of israel; unto thee have I given them by reason of the
anointing, and to thi sons, by an ordin for ever.

18:9 thi shall be thine of the most holi things, reserv from the
fire: everi oblat of theirs, everi meat offer of theirs, and
everi sin offer of theirs, and everi trespass offer of theirs
which they shall render unto me, shall be most holi for thee and for
thi sons.

18:10 In the most holi place shalt thou eat it; everi male shall eat
it: it shall be holi unto thee.

18:11 and thi is thine; the heav offer of their gift, with all
th wave offer of the children of israel: I have given them unto
thee, and to thi son and to thi daughter with thee, by a statut for
ever: everi one that is clean in thi hous shall eat of it.

18:12 all the best of the oil, and all the best of the wine, and of
th wheat, the firstfruit of them which they shall offer unto the
lord, them have I given thee.

18:13 and whatsoev is first ripe in the land, which they shall bring
unto the lord, shall be thine; everi one that is clean in thine house
shal eat of it.

18:14 everi thing devot in israel shall be thine.

18:15 everi thing that openeth the matrix in all flesh, which they
br unto the lord, whether it be of men or beasts, shall be thine:
nevertheless the firstborn of man shalt thou sure redeem, and the
firstl of unclean beast shalt thou redeem.

18:16 and those that are to be redeem from a month old shalt thou
redeem, accord to thine estimation, for the money of five shekels,
aft the shekel of the sanctuary, which is twenti gerahs.

18:17 but the firstl of a cow, or the firstl of a sheep, or the
firstl of a goat, thou shalt not redeem; they are holy: thou shalt
sprinkl their blood upon the altar, and shalt burn their fat for an
off made by fire, for a sweet savour unto the lord.

18:18 and the flesh of them shall be thine, as the wave breast and as
th right shoulder are thine.

18:19 all the heav offer of the holi things, which the children
of israel offer unto the lord, have I given thee, and thi son and thy
daught with thee, by a statut for ever: it is a coven of salt
for ever befor the lord unto thee and to thi seed with thee.

18:20 and the lord spake unto aaron, thou shalt have no inherit in
their land, neither shalt thou have ani part among them: I am thi part
and thine inherit among the children of israel.

18:21 and, behold, I have given the children of levi all the tenth in
israel for an inheritance, for their servic which they serve, even
th servic of the tabernacl of the congregation.

18:22 neither must the children of israel henceforth come nigh the
tabernacl of the congregation, lest they bear sin, and die.

18:23 but the levit shall do the servic of the tabernacl of the
congregation, and they shall bear their iniquity: it shall be a
statut for ever throughout your generations, that among the children
of israel they have no inheritance.

18:24 but the tith of the children of israel, which they offer as an
heav offer unto the lord, I have given to the levit to inherit:
therefor I have said unto them, among the children of israel they
shal have no inheritance.

18:25 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 18:26 thu speak unto the
levites, and say unto them, when ye take of the children of israel the
tith which I have given you from them for your inheritance, then ye
shal offer up an heav offer of it for the lord, even a tenth part
of the tithe.

18:27 and thi your heav offer shall be reckon unto you, as
though it were the corn of the threshingfloor, and as the ful of
th winepress.

18:28 thu ye also shall offer an heav offer unto the lord of all
your tithes, which ye receiv of the children of israel; and ye shall
giv thereof the lord' heav offer to aaron the priest.

18:29 out of all your gift ye shall offer everi heav offer of the
lord, of all the best thereof, even the hallow part thereof out of
it.

18:30 therefor thou shalt say unto them, when ye have heav the best
thereof from it, then it shall be count unto the levit as the
increas of the threshingfloor, and as the increas of the winepress.

18:31 and ye shall eat it in everi place, ye and your households: for
it is your reward for your servic in the tabernacl of the
congregation.

18:32 and ye shall bear no sin by reason of it, when ye have heaved
from it the best of it: neither shall ye pollut the holi thing of
th children of israel, lest ye die.

19:1 and the lord spake unto mose and unto aaron, saying, 19:2 this
i the ordin of the law which the lord hath commanded, saying,
speak unto the children of israel, that they bring thee a red heifer
without spot, wherein is no blemish, and upon which never came yoke:
19:3 and ye shall give her unto eleazar the priest, that he may bring
her forth without the camp, and one shall slay her befor hi face:
19:4 and eleazar the priest shall take of her blood with hi finger,
and sprinkl of her blood directli befor the tabernacl of the
congreg seven times: 19:5 and one shall burn the heifer in his
sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he
burn: 19:6 and the priest shall take cedar wood, and hyssop, and
scarlet, and cast it into the midst of the burn of the heifer.

19:7 then the priest shall wash hi clothes, and he shall bath his
flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp, and the
priest shall be unclean until the even.

19:8 and he that burneth her shall wash hi cloth in water, and
bath hi flesh in water, and shall be unclean until the even.

19:9 and a man that is clean shall gather up the ash of the heifer,
and lay them up without the camp in a clean place, and it shall be
kept for the congreg of the children of israel for a water of
separation: it is a purif for sin.

19:10 and he that gathereth the ash of the heifer shall wash his
clothes, and be unclean until the even: and it shall be unto the
children of israel, and unto the stranger that sojourneth among them,
for a statut for ever.

19:11 He that toucheth the dead bodi of ani man shall be unclean seven
days.

19:12 He shall purifi himself with it on the third day, and on the
seventh day he shall be clean: but if he purifi not himself the third
day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.

19:13 whosoev toucheth the dead bodi of ani man that is dead, and
purifieth not himself, defileth the tabernacl of the lord; and that
soul shall be cut off from israel: becaus the water of separ was
not sprinkl upon him, he shall be unclean; hi unclean is yet
upon him.

19:14 thi is the law, when a man dieth in a tent: all that come into
th tent, and all that is in the tent, shall be unclean seven days.

19:15 and everi open vessel, which hath no cover bound upon it, is
unclean.

19:16 and whosoev toucheth one that is slain with a sword in the
open fields, or a dead body, or a bone of a man, or a grave, shall be
unclean seven days.

19:17 and for an unclean person they shall take of the ash of the
burnt heifer of purif for sin, and run water shall be put
thereto in a vessel: 19:18 and a clean person shall take hyssop, and
dip it in the water, and sprinkl it upon the tent, and upon all the
vessels, and upon the person that were there, and upon him that
touch a bone, or one slain, or one dead, or a grave: 19:19 and the
clean person shall sprinkl upon the unclean on the third day, and on
th seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purifi himself, and
wash hi clothes, and bath himself in water, and shall be clean at
even.

19:20 but the man that shall be unclean, and shall not purifi himself,
that soul shall be cut off from among the congregation, becaus he
hath defil the sanctuari of the lord: the water of separ hath
not been sprinkl upon him; he is unclean.

19:21 and it shall be a perpetu statut unto them, that he that
sprinkleth the water of separ shall wash hi clothes; and he that
toucheth the water of separ shall be unclean until even.

19:22 and whatsoev the unclean person toucheth shall be unclean; and
th soul that toucheth it shall be unclean until even.

20:1 then came the children of israel, even the whole congregation,
into the desert of zin in the first month: and the peopl abod in
kadesh; and miriam die there, and wa buri there.

20:2 and there wa no water for the congregation: and they gathered
themselv togeth against mose and against aaron.

20:3 and the peopl chode with moses, and spake, saying, would god
that we had die when our brethren die befor the lord!  20:4 and why
hav ye brought up the congreg of the lord into thi wilderness,
that we and our cattl should die there?  20:5 and wherefor have ye
mad us to come up out of egypt, to bring us in unto thi evil place?
it is no place of seed, or of figs, or of vines, or of pomegranates;
neith is there ani water to drink.

20:6 and mose and aaron went from the presenc of the assembl unto
th door of the tabernacl of the congregation, and they fell upon
their faces: and the glori of the lord appear unto them.

20:7 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 20:8 take the rod, and
gath thou the assembl together, thou, and aaron thi brother, and
speak ye unto the rock befor their eyes; and it shall give forth his
water, and thou shalt bring forth to them water out of the rock: so
thou shalt give the congreg and their beast drink.

20:9 and mose took the rod from befor the lord, as he command him.

20:10 and mose and aaron gather the congreg togeth before
th rock, and he said unto them, hear now, ye rebels; must we fetch
you water out of thi rock?  20:11 and mose lift up hi hand, and
with hi rod he smote the rock twice: and the water came out
abundantly, and the congreg drank, and their beast also.

20:12 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron, becaus ye believ me
not, to sanctifi me in the eye of the children of israel, therefore
y shall not bring thi congreg into the land which I have given
them.

20:13 thi is the water of meribah; becaus the children of israel
strov with the lord, and he wa sanctifi in them.

20:14 and mose sent messeng from kadesh unto the king of edom,
thu saith thi brother israel, thou knowest all the travail that hath
befallen us: 20:15 how our father went down into egypt, and we have
dwelt in egypt a long time; and the egyptian vex us, and our
fathers: 20:16 and when we cri unto the lord, he heard our voice,
and sent an angel, and hath brought us forth out of egypt: and,
behold, we are in kadesh, a citi in the uttermost of thi border: 20:17
let us pass, I pray thee, through thi country: we will not pass
through the fields, or through the vineyards, neither will we drink of
th water of the wells: we will go by the king' high way, we will not
turn to the right hand nor to the left, until we have pass thy
borders.

20:18 and edom said unto him, thou shalt not pass by me, lest I come
out against thee with the sword.

20:19 and the children of israel said unto him, We will go by the high
way: and if I and my cattl drink of thi water, then I will pay for
it: I will only, without do anyth else, go through on my feet.

20:20 and he said, thou shalt not go through. and edom came out
against him with much people, and with a strong hand.

20:21 thu edom refus to give israel passag through hi border:
wherefor israel turn away from him.

20:22 and the children of israel, even the whole congregation,
journey from kadesh, and came unto mount hor.

20:23 and the lord spake unto mose and aaron in mount hor, by the
coast of the land of edom, saying, 20:24 aaron shall be gather unto
hi people: for he shall not enter into the land which I have given
unto the children of israel, becaus ye rebel against my word at
th water of meribah.

20:25 take aaron and eleazar hi son, and bring them up unto mount
hor: 20:26 and strip aaron of hi garments, and put them upon eleazar
hi son: and aaron shall be gather unto hi people, and shall die
there.

20:27 and mose did as the lord commanded: and they went up into mount
hor in the sight of all the congregation.

20:28 and mose strip aaron of hi garments, and put them upon
eleazar hi son; and aaron die there in the top of the mount: and
mos and eleazar came down from the mount.

20:29 and when all the congreg saw that aaron wa dead, they
mourn for aaron thirti days, even all the hous of israel.

21:1 and when king arad the canaanite, which dwelt in the south, heard
tel that israel came by the way of the spies; then he fought against
israel, and took some of them prisoners.

21:2 and israel vow a vow unto the lord, and said, If thou wilt
inde deliv thi peopl into my hand, then I will utterli destroy
their cities.

21:3 and the lord hearken to the voic of israel, and deliv up
th canaanites; and they utterli destroy them and their cities: and
h call the name of the place hormah.

21:4 and they journey from mount hor by the way of the red sea, to
compass the land of edom: and the soul of the peopl wa much
discourag becaus of the way.

21:5 and the peopl spake against god, and against moses, wherefore
hav ye brought us up out of egypt to die in the wilderness? for there
i no bread, neither is there ani water; and our soul loatheth this
light bread.

21:6 and the lord sent fieri serpent among the people, and they bit
th people; and much peopl of israel died.

21:7 therefor the peopl came to moses, and said, We have sinned, for
w have spoken against the lord, and against thee; pray unto the lord,
that he take away the serpent from us. and mose pray for the
people.

21:8 and the lord said unto moses, make thee a fieri serpent, and set
it upon a pole: and it shall come to pass, that everi one that is
bitten, when he looketh upon it, shall live.

21:9 and mose made a serpent of brass, and put it upon a pole, and it
cam to pass, that if a serpent had bitten ani man, when he beheld the
serp of brass, he lived.

21:10 and the children of israel set forward, and pitch in oboth.

21:11 and they journey from oboth, and pitch at ijeabarim, in the
wild which is befor moab, toward the sunrising.

21:12 from thenc they removed, and pitch in the valley of zared.

21:13 from thenc they removed, and pitch on the other side of
arnon, which is in the wilder that cometh out of the coast of the
amorites: for arnon is the border of moab, between moab and the
amorites.

21:14 wherefor it is said in the book of the war of the lord, what
h did in the red sea, and in the brook of arnon, 21:15 and at the
stream of the brook that goeth down to the dwell of ar, and lieth
upon the border of moab.

21:16 and from thenc they went to beer: that is the well whereof the
lord spake unto moses, gather the peopl together, and I will give
them water.

21:17 then israel sang thi song, spring up, O well; sing ye unto it:
21:18 the princ dig the well, the nobl of the peopl dig it,
bi the direct of the lawgiver, with their staves. and from the
wild they went to mattanah: 21:19 and from mattanah to nahaliel:
and from nahaliel to bamoth: 21:20 and from bamoth in the valley, that
i in the countri of moab, to the top of pisgah, which looketh toward
jeshimon.

21:21 and israel sent messeng unto sihon king of the amorites,
saying, 21:22 let me pass through thi land: we will not turn into the
fields, or into the vineyards; we will not drink of the water of the
well: but we will go along by the king' high way, until we be past
thi borders.

21:23 and sihon would not suffer israel to pass through hi border:
but sihon gather all hi peopl together, and went out against
israel into the wilderness: and he came to jahaz, and fought against
israel.

21:24 and israel smote him with the edg of the sword, and possessed
hi land from arnon unto jabbok, even unto the children of ammon: for
th border of the children of ammon wa strong.

21:25 and israel took all these cities: and israel dwelt in all the
citi of the amorites, in heshbon, and in all the villag thereof.

21:26 for heshbon wa the citi of sihon the king of the amorites, who
had fought against the former king of moab, and taken all hi land out
of hi hand, even unto arnon.

21:27 wherefor they that speak in proverb say, come into heshbon,
let the citi of sihon be built and prepared: 21:28 for there is a fire
gon out of heshbon, a flame from the citi of sihon: it hath consumed
ar of moab, and the lord of the high place of arnon.

21:29 woe to thee, moab! thou art undone, O peopl of chemosh: he hath
given hi son that escaped, and hi daughters, into captiv unto
sihon king of the amorites.

21:30 We have shot at them; heshbon is perish even unto dibon, and
w have laid them wast even unto nophah, which reacheth unto medeba.

21:31 thu israel dwelt in the land of the amorites.

21:32 and mose sent to spi out jaazer, and they took the villages
thereof, and drove out the amorit that were there.

21:33 and they turn and went up by the way of bashan: and Og the
k of bashan went out against them, he, and all hi people, to the
battl at edrei.

21:34 and the lord said unto moses, fear him not: for I have delivered
him into thi hand, and all hi people, and hi land; and thou shalt do
to him as thou didst unto sihon king of the amorites, which dwelt at
heshbon.

21:35 So they smote him, and hi sons, and all hi people, until there
wa none left him alive: and they possess hi land.

22:1 and the children of israel set forward, and pitch in the plains
of moab on thi side jordan by jericho.

22:2 and balak the son of zippor saw all that israel had done to the
amorites.

22:3 and moab wa sore afraid of the people, becaus they were many:
and moab wa distress becaus of the children of israel.

22:4 and moab said unto the elder of midian, now shall thi company
lick up all that are round about us, as the ox licketh up the grass of
th field.

and balak the son of zippor wa king of the moabit at that time.

22:5 He sent messeng therefor unto balaam the son of beor to
pethor, which is by the river of the land of the children of his
people, to call him, saying, behold, there is a peopl come out from
egypt: behold, they cover the face of the earth, and they abid over
against me: 22:6 come now therefore, I pray thee, curs me this
people; for they are too mighti for me: peradventur I shall prevail,
that we may smite them, and that I may drive them out of the land: for
i wot that he whom thou blessest is blessed, and he whom thou cursest
i cursed.

22:7 and the elder of moab and the elder of midian depart with the
reward of divin in their hand; and they came unto balaam, and
spak unto him the word of balak.

22:8 and he said unto them, lodg here thi night, and I will bring
you word again, as the lord shall speak unto me: and the princ of
moab abod with balaam.

22:9 and god came unto balaam, and said, what men are these with thee?
22:10 and balaam said unto god, balak the son of zippor, king of moab,
hath sent unto me, saying, 22:11 behold, there is a peopl come out of
egypt, which covereth the face of the earth: come now, curs me them;
peradventur I shall be abl to overcom them, and drive them out.

22:12 and god said unto balaam, thou shalt not go with them; thou
shalt not curs the people: for they are blessed.

22:13 and balaam rose up in the morning, and said unto the princ of
balak, get you into your land: for the lord refuseth to give me leave
to go with you.

22:14 and the princ of moab rose up, and they went unto balak, and
said, balaam refuseth to come with us.

22:15 and balak sent yet again princes, more, and more honour than
they.

22:16 and they came to balaam, and said to him, thu saith balak the
son of zippor, let nothing, I pray thee, hinder thee from come unto
me: 22:17 for I will promot thee unto veri great honour, and I will
do whatsoev thou sayest unto me: come therefore, I pray thee, curse
m thi people.

22:18 and balaam answer and said unto the servant of balak, if
balak would give me hi hous full of silver and gold, I cannot go
beyond the word of the lord my god, to do less or more.

22:19 now therefore, I pray you, tarri ye also here thi night, that i
may know what the lord will say unto me more.

22:20 and god came unto balaam at night, and said unto him, If the men
com to call thee, rise up, and go with them; but yet the word which i
shal say unto thee, that shalt thou do.

22:21 and balaam rose up in the morning, and saddl hi ass, and went
with the princ of moab.

22:22 and god' anger wa kindl becaus he went: and the angel of
th lord stood in the way for an adversari against him. now he was
rid upon hi ass, and hi two servant were with him.

22:23 and the ass saw the angel of the lord stand in the way, and
hi sword drawn in hi hand: and the ass turn asid out of the way,
and went into the field: and balaam smote the ass, to turn her into
th way.

22:24 but the angel of the lord stood in a path of the vineyards, a
wal be on thi side, and a wall on that side.

22:25 and when the ass saw the angel of the lord, she thrust herself
unto the wall, and crush balaam' foot against the wall: and he
smot her again.

22:26 and the angel of the lord went further, and stood in a narrow
place, where wa no way to turn either to the right hand or to the
left.

22:27 and when the ass saw the angel of the lord, she fell down under
balaam: and balaam' anger wa kindled, and he smote the ass with a
staff.

22:28 and the lord open the mouth of the ass, and she said unto
balaam, what have I done unto thee, that thou hast smitten me these
thre times?  22:29 and balaam said unto the ass, becaus thou hast
mock me: I would there were a sword in mine hand, for now would i
kil thee.

22:30 and the ass said unto balaam, Am not I thine ass, upon which
thou hast ridden ever sinc I wa thine unto thi day? wa I ever wont
to do so unto thee? and he said, nay.

22:31 then the lord open the eye of balaam, and he saw the angel of
th lord stand in the way, and hi sword drawn in hi hand: and he
bow down hi head, and fell flat on hi face.

22:32 and the angel of the lord said unto him, wherefor hast thou
smitten thine ass these three times? behold, I went out to withstand
thee, becaus thi way is pervers befor me: 22:33 and the ass saw me,
and turn from me these three times: unless she had turn from me,
sur now also I had slain thee, and save her alive.

22:34 and balaam said unto the angel of the lord, I have sinned; for i
knew not that thou stoodest in the way against me: now therefore, if
it displeas thee, I will get me back again.

22:35 and the angel of the lord said unto balaam, Go with the men: but
onli the word that I shall speak unto thee, that thou shalt speak. so
balaam went with the princ of balak.

22:36 and when balak heard that balaam wa come, he went out to meet
him unto a citi of moab, which is in the border of arnon, which is in
th utmost coast.

22:37 and balak said unto balaam, did I not earnestli send unto thee
to call thee? wherefor camest thou not unto me? am I not abl indeed
to promot thee to honour?  22:38 and balaam said unto balak, lo, I am
com unto thee: have I now ani power at all to say ani thing? the word
that god putteth in my mouth, that shall I speak.

22:39 and balaam went with balak, and they came unto kirjathhuzoth.

22:40 and balak offer oxen and sheep, and sent to balaam, and to the
princ that were with him.

22:41 and it came to pass on the morrow, that balak took balaam, and
brought him up into the high place of baal, that thenc he might see
th utmost part of the people.

23:1 and balaam said unto balak, build me here seven altars, and
prepar me here seven oxen and seven rams.

23:2 and balak did as balaam had spoken; and balak and balaam offered
on everi altar a bullock and a ram.

23:3 and balaam said unto balak, stand by thi burnt offering, and i
wil go: peradventur the lord will come to meet me: and whatsoev he
sheweth me I will tell thee. and he went to an high place.

23:4 and god met balaam: and he said unto him, I have prepar seven
altars, and I have offer upon everi altar a bullock and a ram.

23:5 and the lord put a word in balaam' mouth, and said, return unto
balak, and thu thou shalt speak.

23:6 and he return unto him, and, lo, he stood by hi burnt
sacrifice, he, and all the princ of moab.

23:7 and he took up hi parable, and said, balak the king of moab hath
brought me from aram, out of the mountain of the east, saying, come,
curs me jacob, and come, defi israel.

23:8 how shall I curse, whom god hath not cursed? or how shall I defy,
whom the lord hath not defied?  23:9 for from the top of the rock i
se him, and from the hill I behold him: lo, the peopl shall dwell
alone, and shall not be reckon among the nations.

23:10 who can count the dust of jacob, and the number of the fourth
part of israel? let me die the death of the righteous, and let my last
end be like his!  23:11 and balak said unto balaam, what hast thou
don unto me? I took thee to curs mine enemies, and, behold, thou
hast bless them altogether.

23:12 and he answer and said, must I not take heed to speak that
which the lord hath put in my mouth?  23:13 and balak said unto him,
come, I pray thee, with me unto anoth place, from whenc thou mayest
se them: thou shalt see but the utmost part of them, and shalt not
se them all: and curs me them from thence.

23:14 and he brought him into the field of zophim, to the top of
pisgah, and built seven altars, and offer a bullock and a ram on
everi altar.

23:15 and he said unto balak, stand here by thi burnt offering, while
i meet the lord yonder.

23:16 and the lord met balaam, and put a word in hi mouth, and said,
go again unto balak, and say thus.

23:17 and when he came to him, behold, he stood by hi burnt offering,
and the princ of moab with him. and balak said unto him, what hath
th lord spoken?  23:18 and he took up hi parable, and said, rise up,
balak, and hear; hearken unto me, thou son of zippor: 23:19 god is not
a man, that he should lie; neither the son of man, that he should
repent: hath he said, and shall he not do it? or hath he spoken, and
shal he not make it good?  23:20 behold, I have receiv commandment
to bless: and he hath blessed; and I cannot revers it.

23:21 He hath not beheld iniqu in jacob, neither hath he seen
pervers in israel: the lord hi god is with him, and the shout of
a king is among them.

23:22 god brought them out of egypt; he hath as it were the strength
of an unicorn.

23:23 sure there is no enchant against jacob, neither is there
ani divin against israel: accord to thi time it shall be said
of jacob and of israel, what hath god wrought!  23:24 behold, the
peopl shall rise up as a great lion, and lift up himself as a young
lion: he shall not lie down until he eat of the prey, and drink the
blood of the slain.

23:25 and balak said unto balaam, neither curs them at all, nor bless
them at all.

23:26 but balaam answer and said unto balak, told not I thee,
saying, all that the lord speaketh, that I must do?  23:27 and balak
said unto balaam, come, I pray thee, I will bring thee unto another
place; peradventur it will pleas god that thou mayest curs me them
from thence.

23:28 and balak brought balaam unto the top of peor, that looketh
toward jeshimon.

23:29 and balaam said unto balak, build me here seven altars, and
prepar me here seven bullock and seven rams.

23:30 and balak did as balaam had said, and offer a bullock and a
ram on everi altar.

24:1 and when balaam saw that it pleas the lord to bless israel, he
went not, as at other times, to seek for enchantments, but he set his
fac toward the wilderness.

24:2 and balaam lift up hi eyes, and he saw israel abid in his
tent accord to their tribes; and the spirit of god came upon him.

24:3 and he took up hi parable, and said, balaam the son of beor hath
said, and the man whose eye are open hath said: 24:4 He hath said,
which heard the word of god, which saw the vision of the almighty,
fal into a trance, but have hi eye open: 24:5 how goodli are
thi tents, O jacob, and thi tabernacles, O israel!  24:6 As the
valley are they spread forth, as garden by the river' side, as the
tre of lign alo which the lord hath planted, and as cedar trees
besid the waters.

24:7 He shall pour the water out of hi buckets, and hi seed shall be
in mani waters, and hi king shall be higher than agag, and his
kingdom shall be exalted.

24:8 god brought him forth out of egypt; he hath as it were the
strength of an unicorn: he shall eat up the nation hi enemies, and
shal break their bones, and pierc them through with hi arrows.

24:9 He couched, he lay down as a lion, and as a great lion: who shall
stir him up? bless is he that blesseth thee, and curs is he that
curseth thee.

24:10 and balak' anger wa kindl against balaam, and he smote his
hand together: and balak said unto balaam, I call thee to curse
min enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogeth bless them these
thre times.

24:11 therefor now flee thou to thi place: I thought to promot thee
unto great honour; but, lo, the lord hath kept thee back from honour.

24:12 and balaam said unto balak, spake I not also to thi messengers
which thou sentest unto me, saying, 24:13 If balak would give me his
hous full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the command of
th lord, to do either good or bad of mine own mind; but what the lord
saith, that will I speak?  24:14 and now, behold, I go unto my people:
com therefore, and I will advertis thee what thi peopl shall do to
thi peopl in the latter days.

24:15 and he took up hi parable, and said, balaam the son of beor
hath said, and the man whose eye are open hath said: 24:16 He hath
said, which heard the word of god, and knew the knowledg of the most
high, which saw the vision of the almighty, fall into a trance, but
hav hi eye open: 24:17 I shall see him, but not now: I shall
behold him, but not nigh: there shall come a star out of jacob, and a
sceptr shall rise out of israel, and shall smite the corner of moab,
and destroy all the children of sheth.

24:18 and edom shall be a possession, seir also shall be a possession
for hi enemies; and israel shall do valiantly.

24:19 out of jacob shall come he that shall have dominion, and shall
destroy him that remaineth of the city.

24:20 and when he look on amalek, he took up hi parable, and said,
amalek wa the first of the nations; but hi latter end shall be that
h perish for ever.

24:21 and he look on the kenites, and took up hi parable, and said,
strong is thi dwellingplace, and thou puttest thi nest in a rock.

24:22 nevertheless the kenit shall be wasted, until asshur shall
carri thee away captive.

24:23 and he took up hi parable, and said, alas, who shall live when
god doeth this!  24:24 and ship shall come from the coast of chittim,
and shall afflict asshur, and shall afflict eber, and he also shall
perish for ever.

24:25 and balaam rose up, and went and return to hi place: and
balak also went hi way.

25:1 and israel abod in shittim, and the peopl began to commit
whoredom with the daughter of moab.

25:2 and they call the peopl unto the sacrific of their gods: and
th peopl did eat, and bow down to their gods.

25:3 and israel join himself unto baalpeor: and the anger of the
lord wa kindl against israel.

25:4 and the lord said unto moses, take all the head of the people,
and hang them up befor the lord against the sun, that the fierce
ang of the lord may be turn away from israel.

25:5 and mose said unto the judg of israel, slay ye everi one his
men that were join unto baalpeor.

25:6 and, behold, one of the children of israel came and brought unto
hi brethren a midianitish woman in the sight of moses, and in the
sight of all the congreg of the children of israel, who were
weep befor the door of the tabernacl of the congregation.

25:7 and when phinehas, the son of eleazar, the son of aaron the
priest, saw it, he rose up from among the congregation, and took a
javelin in hi hand; 25:8 and he went after the man of israel into the
tent, and thrust both of them through, the man of israel, and the
woman through her belly. So the plagu wa stay from the children of
israel.

25:9 and those that die in the plagu were twenti and four thousand.

25:10 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 25:11 phinehas, the son
of eleazar, the son of aaron the priest, hath turn my wrath away
from the children of israel, while he wa zealou for my sake among
them, that I consum not the children of israel in my jealousy.

25:12 wherefor say, behold, I give unto him my coven of peace:
25:13 and he shall have it, and hi seed after him, even the covenant
of an everlast priesthood; becaus he wa zealou for hi god, and
mad an aton for the children of israel.

25:14 now the name of the israelit that wa slain, even that was
slain with the midianitish woman, wa zimri, the son of salu, a prince
of a chief hous among the simeonites.

25:15 and the name of the midianitish woman that wa slain wa cozbi,
th daughter of zur; he wa head over a people, and of a chief house
in midian.

25:16 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 25:17 vex the midianites,
and smite them: 25:18 for they vex you with their wiles, wherewith
they have beguil you in the matter of peor, and in the matter of
cozbi, the daughter of a princ of midian, their sister, which was
slain in the day of the plagu for peor' sake.

26:1 and it came to pass after the plague, that the lord spake unto
mos and unto eleazar the son of aaron the priest, saying, 26:2 take
th sum of all the congreg of the children of israel, from twenty
year old and upward, throughout their fathers' house, all that are
 to go to war in israel.

26:3 and mose and eleazar the priest spake with them in the plain of
moab by jordan near jericho, saying, 26:4 take the sum of the people,
from twenti year old and upward; as the lord command mose and the
children of israel, which went forth out of the land of egypt.

26:5 reuben, the eldest son of israel: the children of reuben; hanoch,
of whom cometh the famili of the hanochites: of pallu, the famili of
th palluites: 26:6 Of hezron, the famili of the hezronites: of carmi,
th famili of the carmites.

26:7 these are the famili of the reubenites: and they that were
numb of them were forti and three thousand and seven hundr and
thirty.

26:8 and the son of pallu; eliab.

26:9 and the son of eliab; nemuel, and dathan, and abiram. thi is
that dathan and abiram, which were famou in the congregation, who
strov against mose and against aaron in the compani of korah, when
they strove against the lord: 26:10 and the earth open her mouth,
and swallow them up togeth with korah, when that compani died,
what time the fire devour two hundr and fifti men: and they became
a sign.

26:11 notwithstand the children of korah die not.

26:12 the son of simeon after their families: of nemuel, the family
of the nemuelites: of jamin, the famili of the jaminites: of jachin,
th famili of the jachinites: 26:13 Of zerah, the famili of the
zarhites: of shaul, the famili of the shaulites.

26:14 these are the famili of the simeonites, twenti and two
thousand and two hundred.

26:15 the children of gad after their families: of zephon, the family
of the zephonites: of haggi, the famili of the haggites: of shuni, the
famili of the shunites: 26:16 Of ozni, the famili of the oznites: of
eri, the famili of the erites: 26:17 Of arod, the famili of the
arodites: of areli, the famili of the arelites.

26:18 these are the famili of the children of gad accord to those
that were number of them, forti thousand and five hundred.

26:19 the son of judah were Er and onan: and Er and onan die in the
land of canaan.

26:20 and the son of judah after their famili were; of shelah, the
famili of the shelanites: of pharez, the famili of the pharzites: of
zerah, the famili of the zarhites.

26:21 and the son of pharez were; of hezron, the famili of the
hezronites: of hamul, the famili of the hamulites.

26:22 these are the famili of judah accord to those that were
numb of them, threescor and sixteen thousand and five hundred.

26:23 Of the son of issachar after their families: of tola, the
famili of the tolaites: of pua, the famili of the punites: 26:24 of
jashub, the famili of the jashubites: of shimron, the famili of the
shimronites.

26:25 these are the famili of issachar accord to those that were
numb of them, threescor and four thousand and three hundred.

26:26 Of the son of zebulun after their families: of sered, the
famili of the sardites: of elon, the famili of the elonites: of
jahleel, the famili of the jahleelites.

26:27 these are the famili of the zebulunit accord to those
that were number of them, threescor thousand and five hundred.

26:28 the son of joseph after their famili were manasseh and
ephraim.

26:29 Of the son of manasseh: of machir, the famili of the
machirites: and machir begat gilead: of gilead come the famili of the
gileadites.

26:30 these are the son of gilead: of jeezer, the famili of the
jeezerites: of helek, the famili of the helekites: 26:31 and of
asriel, the famili of the asrielites: and of shechem, the famili of
th shechemites: 26:32 and of shemida, the famili of the shemidaites:
and of hepher, the famili of the hepherites.

26:33 and zelophehad the son of hepher had no sons, but daughters: and
th name of the daughter of zelophehad were mahlah, and noah,
hoglah, milcah, and tirzah.

26:34 these are the famili of manasseh, and those that were numbered
of them, fifti and two thousand and seven hundred.

26:35 these are the son of ephraim after their families: of
shuthelah, the famili of the shuthalhites: of becher, the famili of
th bachrites: of tahan, the famili of the tahanites.

26:36 and these are the son of shuthelah: of eran, the famili of the
eranites.

26:37 these are the famili of the son of ephraim accord to those
that were number of them, thirti and two thousand and five hundred.
thes are the son of joseph after their families.

26:38 the son of benjamin after their families: of bela, the family
of the belaites: of ashbel, the famili of the ashbelites: of ahiram,
th famili of the ahiramites: 26:39 Of shupham, the famili of the
shuphamites: of hupham, the famili of the huphamites.

26:40 and the son of bela were ard and naaman: of ard, the famili of
th ardites: and of naaman, the famili of the naamites.

26:41 these are the son of benjamin after their families: and they
that were number of them were forti and five thousand and six
hundred.

26:42 these are the son of dan after their families: of shuham, the
famili of the shuhamites. these are the famili of dan after their
families.

26:43 all the famili of the shuhamites, accord to those that were
numb of them, were threescor and four thousand and four hundred.

26:44 Of the children of asher after their families: of jimna, the
famili of the jimnites: of jesui, the famili of the jesuites: of
beriah, the famili of the beriites.

26:45 Of the son of beriah: of heber, the famili of the heberites: of
malchiel, the famili of the malchielites.

26:46 and the name of the daughter of asher wa sarah.

26:47 these are the famili of the son of asher accord to those
that were number of them; who were fifti and three thousand and four
hundred.

26:48 Of the son of naphtali after their families: of jahzeel, the
famili of the jahzeelites: of guni, the famili of the gunites: 26:49
of jezer, the famili of the jezerites: of shillem, the famili of the
shillemites.

26:50 these are the famili of naphtali accord to their families:
and they that were number of them were forti and five thousand and
four hundred.

26:51 these were the number of the children of israel, six hundred
thousand and a thousand seven hundr and thirty.

26:52 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 26:53 unto these the land
shal be divid for an inherit accord to the number of names.

26:54 To mani thou shalt give the more inheritance, and to few thou
shalt give the less inheritance: to everi one shall hi inherit be
given accord to those that were number of him.

26:55 notwithstand the land shall be divid by lot: accord to
th name of the tribe of their father they shall inherit.

26:56 accord to the lot shall the possess thereof be divided
between mani and few.

26:57 and these are they that were number of the levit after their
families: of gershon, the famili of the gershonites: of kohath, the
famili of the kohathites: of merari, the famili of the merarites.

26:58 these are the famili of the levites: the famili of the
libnites, the famili of the hebronites, the famili of the mahlites,
th famili of the mushites, the famili of the korathites. and kohath
begat amram.

26:59 and the name of amram' wife wa jochebed, the daughter of levi,
whom her mother bare to levi in egypt: and she bare unto amram aaron
and moses, and miriam their sister.

26:60 and unto aaron wa born nadab, and abihu, eleazar, and ithamar.

26:61 and nadab and abihu died, when they offer strang fire before
th lord.

26:62 and those that were number of them were twenti and three
thousand, all male from a month old and upward: for they were not
numb among the children of israel, becaus there wa no
inherit given them among the children of israel.

26:63 these are they that were number by mose and eleazar the
priest, who number the children of israel in the plain of moab by
jordan near jericho.

26:64 but among these there wa not a man of them whom mose and aaron
th priest numbered, when they number the children of israel in the
wild of sinai.

26:65 for the lord had said of them, they shall sure die in the
wilderness. and there wa not left a man of them, save caleb the son
of jephunneh, and joshua the son of nun.

27:1 then came the daughter of zelophehad, the son of hepher, the son
of gilead, the son of machir, the son of manasseh, of the famili of
manasseh the son of joseph: and these are the name of hi daughters;
mahlah, noah, and hoglah, and milcah, and tirzah.

27:2 and they stood befor moses, and befor eleazar the priest, and
befor the princ and all the congregation, by the door of the
tabernacl of the congregation, saying, 27:3 our father die in the
wilderness, and he wa not in the compani of them that gathered
themselv togeth against the lord in the compani of korah; but died
in hi own sin, and had no sons.

27:4 whi should the name of our father be done away from among his
family, becaus he hath no son? give unto us therefor a possession
among the brethren of our father.

27:5 and mose brought their caus befor the lord.

27:6 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 27:7 the daughter of
zelophehad speak right: thou shalt sure give them a possess of an
inherit among their father' brethren; and thou shalt caus the
inherit of their father to pass unto them.

27:8 and thou shalt speak unto the children of israel, saying, If a
man die, and have no son, then ye shall caus hi inherit to pass
unto hi daughter.

27:9 and if he have no daughter, then ye shall give hi inheritance
unto hi brethren.

27:10 and if he have no brethren, then ye shall give hi inheritance
unto hi father' brethren.

27:11 and if hi father have no brethren, then ye shall give his
inherit unto hi kinsman that is next to him of hi family, and he
shal possess it: and it shall be unto the children of israel a
statut of judgment, as the lord command moses.

27:12 and the lord said unto moses, get thee up into thi mount
abarim, and see the land which I have given unto the children of
israel.

27:13 and when thou hast seen it, thou also shalt be gather unto thy
people, as aaron thi brother wa gathered.

27:14 for ye rebel against my command in the desert of zin, in
th strife of the congregation, to sanctifi me at the water before
their eyes: that is the water of meribah in kadesh in the wilderness
of zin.

27:15 and mose spake unto the lord, saying, 27:16 let the lord, the
god of the spirit of all flesh, set a man over the congregation,
27:17 which may go out befor them, and which may go in befor them,
and which may lead them out, and which may bring them in; that the
congreg of the lord be not as sheep which have no shepherd.

27:18 and the lord said unto moses, take thee joshua the son of nun, a
man in whom is the spirit, and lay thine hand upon him; 27:19 and set
him befor eleazar the priest, and befor all the congregation; and
giv him a charg in their sight.

27:20 and thou shalt put some of thine honour upon him, that all the
congreg of the children of israel may be obedient.

27:21 and he shall stand befor eleazar the priest, who shall ask
counsel for him after the judgment of urim befor the lord: at his
word shall they go out, and at hi word they shall come in, both he,
and all the children of israel with him, even all the congregation.

27:22 and mose did as the lord command him: and he took joshua, and
set him befor eleazar the priest, and befor all the congregation:
27:23 and he laid hi hand upon him, and gave him a charge, as the
lord command by the hand of moses.

28:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 28:2 command the children
of israel, and say unto them, My offering, and my bread for my
sacrific made by fire, for a sweet savour unto me, shall ye observe
to offer unto me in their due season.

28:3 and thou shalt say unto them, thi is the offer made by fire
which ye shall offer unto the lord; two lamb of the first year
without spot day by day, for a continu burnt offering.

28:4 the one lamb shalt thou offer in the morning, and the other lamb
shalt thou offer at even; 28:5 and a tenth part of an ephah of flour
for a meat offering, mingl with the fourth part of an hin of beaten
oil.

28:6 It is a continu burnt offering, which wa ordain in mount
sinai for a sweet savour, a sacrific made by fire unto the lord.

28:7 and the drink offer thereof shall be the fourth part of an hin
for the one lamb: in the holi place shalt thou caus the strong wine
to be pour unto the lord for a drink offering.

28:8 and the other lamb shalt thou offer at even: as the meat offering
of the morning, and as the drink offer thereof, thou shalt offer
it, a sacrific made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord.

28:9 and on the sabbath day two lamb of the first year without spot,
and two tenth deal of flour for a meat offering, mingl with oil,
and the drink offer thereof: 28:10 thi is the burnt offer of
everi sabbath, besid the continu burnt offering, and hi drink
offering.

28:11 and in the begin of your month ye shall offer a burnt
off unto the lord; two young bullocks, and one ram, seven lambs
of the first year without spot; 28:12 and three tenth deal of flour
for a meat offering, mingl with oil, for one bullock; and two tenth
deal of flour for a meat offering, mingl with oil, for one ram;
28:13 and a sever tenth deal of flour mingl with oil for a meat
off unto one lamb; for a burnt offer of a sweet savour, a
sacrific made by fire unto the lord.

28:14 and their drink offer shall be half an hin of wine unto a
bullock, and the third part of an hin unto a ram, and a fourth part of
an hin unto a lamb: thi is the burnt offer of everi month
throughout the month of the year.

28:15 and one kid of the goat for a sin offer unto the lord shall
b offered, besid the continu burnt offering, and hi drink
offering.

28:16 and in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passov of
th lord.

28:17 and in the fifteenth day of thi month is the feast: seven days
shal unleaven bread be eaten.

28:18 In the first day shall be an holi convocation; ye shall do no
mann of servil work therein: 28:19 but ye shall offer a sacrifice
mad by fire for a burnt offer unto the lord; two young bullocks,
and one ram, and seven lamb of the first year: they shall be unto you
without blemish: 28:20 and their meat offer shall be of flour
mingl with oil: three tenth deal shall ye offer for a bullock, and
two tenth deal for a ram; 28:21 A sever tenth deal shalt thou offer
