for everi lamb, throughout the seven lambs: 28:22 and one goat for a
sin offering, to make an aton for you.

28:23 Ye shall offer these besid the burnt offer in the morning,
which is for a continu burnt offering.

28:24 after thi manner ye shall offer daily, throughout the seven
days, the meat of the sacrific made by fire, of a sweet savour unto
th lord: it shall be offer besid the continu burnt offering, and
hi drink offering.

28:25 and on the seventh day ye shall have an holi convocation; ye
shal do no servil work.

28:26 also in the day of the firstfruits, when ye bring a new meat
off unto the lord, after your week be out, ye shall have an holy
convocation; ye shall do no servil work: 28:27 but ye shall offer the
burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the lord; two young bullocks,
on ram, seven lamb of the first year; 28:28 and their meat offering
of flour mingl with oil, three tenth deal unto one bullock, two
tenth deal unto one ram, 28:29 A sever tenth deal unto one lamb,
throughout the seven lambs; 28:30 and one kid of the goats, to make an
aton for you.

28:31 Ye shall offer them besid the continu burnt offering, and his
meat offering, (they shall be unto you without blemish) and their
drink offerings.

29:1 and in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall
hav an holi convocation; ye shall do no servil work: it is a day of
blow the trumpet unto you.

29:2 and ye shall offer a burnt offer for a sweet savour unto the
lord; one young bullock, one ram, and seven lamb of the first year
without blemish: 29:3 and their meat offer shall be of flour
mingl with oil, three tenth deal for a bullock, and two tenth deals
for a ram, 29:4 and one tenth deal for one lamb, throughout the seven
lambs: 29:5 and one kid of the goat for a sin offering, to make an
aton for you: 29:6 besid the burnt offer of the month, and
hi meat offering, and the daili burnt offering, and hi meat
offering, and their drink offerings, accord unto their manner, for
a sweet savour, a sacrific made by fire unto the lord.

29:7 and ye shall have on the tenth day of thi seventh month an holy
convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls: ye shall not do ani work
therein: 29:8 but ye shall offer a burnt offer unto the lord for a
sweet savour; one young bullock, one ram, and seven lamb of the first
year; they shall be unto you without blemish: 29:9 and their meat
off shall be of flour mingl with oil, three tenth deal to a
bullock, and two tenth deal to one ram, 29:10 A sever tenth deal
for one lamb, throughout the seven lambs: 29:11 one kid of the goats
for a sin offering; besid the sin offer of atonement, and the
continu burnt offering, and the meat offer of it, and their drink
offerings.

29:12 and on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an
holi convocation; ye shall do no servil work, and ye shall keep a
feast unto the lord seven days: 29:13 and ye shall offer a burnt
offering, a sacrific made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord;
thirteen young bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lamb of the first
year; they shall be without blemish: 29:14 and their meat offering
shal be of flour mingl with oil, three tenth deal unto every
bullock of the thirteen bullocks, two tenth deal to each ram of the
two rams, 29:15 and a sever tenth deal to each lamb of the fourteen
lambs: 29:16 and one kid of the goat for a sin offering; besid the
continu burnt offering, hi meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:17 and on the second day ye shall offer twelv young bullocks, two
rams, fourteen lamb of the first year without spot: 29:18 and their
meat offer and their drink offer for the bullocks, for the
rams, and for the lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the
manner: 29:19 and one kid of the goat for a sin offering; besid the
continu burnt offering, and the meat offer thereof, and their
drink offerings.

29:20 and on the third day eleven bullocks, two rams, fourteen lambs
of the first year without blemish; 29:21 and their meat offer and
their drink offer for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the
lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the manner: 29:22 and
on goat for a sin offering; besid the continu burnt offering, and
hi meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:23 and on the fourth day ten bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs
of the first year without blemish: 29:24 their meat offer and their
drink offer for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the lambs,
shal be accord to their number, after the manner: 29:25 and one
kid of the goat for a sin offering; besid the continu burnt
offering, hi meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:26 and on the fifth day nine bullocks, two rams, and fourteen lambs
of the first year without spot: 29:27 and their meat offer and
their drink offer for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the
lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the manner: 29:28 and
on goat for a sin offering; besid the continu burnt offering, and
hi meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:29 and on the sixth day eight bullocks, two rams, and fourteen
lamb of the first year without blemish: 29:30 and their meat offering
and their drink offer for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the
lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the manner: 29:31 and
on goat for a sin offering; besid the continu burnt offering, his
meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:32 and on the seventh day seven bullocks, two rams, and fourteen
lamb of the first year without blemish: 29:33 and their meat offering
and their drink offer for the bullocks, for the rams, and for the
lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the manner: 29:34 and
on goat for a sin offering; besid the continu burnt offering, his
meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:35 On the eighth day ye shall have a solemn assembly: ye shall do
no servil work therein: 29:36 but ye shall offer a burnt offering, a
sacrific made by fire, of a sweet savour unto the lord: one bullock,
on ram, seven lamb of the first year without blemish: 29:37 their
meat offer and their drink offer for the bullock, for the ram,
and for the lambs, shall be accord to their number, after the
manner: 29:38 and one goat for a sin offering; besid the continual
burnt offering, and hi meat offering, and hi drink offering.

29:39 these thing ye shall do unto the lord in your set feasts,
besid your vows, and your freewil offerings, for your burnt
offerings, and for your meat offerings, and for your drink offerings,
and for your peac offerings.

29:40 and mose told the children of israel accord to all that the
lord command moses.

30:1 and mose spake unto the head of the tribe concern the
children of israel, saying, thi is the thing which the lord hath
commanded.

30:2 If a man vow a vow unto the lord, or swear an oath to bind his
soul with a bond; he shall not break hi word, he shall do according
to all that proceedeth out of hi mouth.

30:3 If a woman also vow a vow unto the lord, and bind herself by a
bond, be in her father' hous in her youth; 30:4 and her father
hear her vow, and her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul, and her
fath shall hold hi peac at her; then all her vow shall stand, and
everi bond wherewith she hath bound her soul shall stand.

30:5 but if her father disallow her in the day that he heareth; not
ani of her vows, or of her bond wherewith she hath bound her soul,
shal stand: and the lord shall forgiv her, becaus her father
disallow her.

30:6 and if she had at all an husband, when she vowed, or uttered
ought out of her lips, wherewith she bound her soul; 30:7 and her
husband heard it, and held hi peac at her in the day that he heard
it: then her vow shall stand, and her bond wherewith she bound her
soul shall stand.

30:8 but if her husband disallow her on the day that he heard it;
then he shall make her vow which she vowed, and that which she uttered
with her lips, wherewith she bound her soul, of none effect: and the
lord shall forgiv her.

30:9 but everi vow of a widow, and of her that is divorced, wherewith
they have bound their souls, shall stand against her.

30:10 and if she vow in her husband' house, or bound her soul by a
bond with an oath; 30:11 and her husband heard it, and held hi peace
at her, and disallow her not: then all her vow shall stand, and
everi bond wherewith she bound her soul shall stand.

30:12 but if her husband hath utterli made them void on the day he
heard them; then whatsoev proceed out of her lip concern her
vows, or concern the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband
hath made them void; and the lord shall forgiv her.

30:13 everi vow, and everi bind oath to afflict the soul, her
husband may establish it, or her husband may make it void.

30:14 but if her husband altogeth hold hi peac at her from day to
day; then he establisheth all her vows, or all her bonds, which are
upon her: he confirmeth them, becaus he held hi peac at her in the
day that he heard them.

30:15 but if he shall ani way make them void after that he hath heard
them; then he shall bear her iniquity.

30:16 these are the statutes, which the lord command moses, between
a man and hi wife, between the father and hi daughter, be yet in
her youth in her father' house.

31:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 31:2 aveng the children
of israel of the midianites: afterward shalt thou be gather unto thy
people.

31:3 and mose spake unto the people, saying, arm some of yourselves
unto the war, and let them go against the midianites, and aveng the
lord of midian.

31:4 Of everi tribe a thousand, throughout all the tribe of israel,
shal ye send to the war.

31:5 So there were deliv out of the thousand of israel, a
thousand of everi tribe, twelv thousand arm for war.

31:6 and mose sent them to the war, a thousand of everi tribe, them
and phineha the son of eleazar the priest, to the war, with the holy
instruments, and the trumpet to blow in hi hand.

31:7 and they war against the midianites, as the lord commanded
moses; and they slew all the males.

31:8 and they slew the king of midian, besid the rest of them that
wer slain; namely, evi, and rekem, and zur, and hur, and reba, five
k of midian: balaam also the son of beor they slew with the sword.

31:9 and the children of israel took all the women of midian captives,
and their littl ones, and took the spoil of all their cattle, and all
their flocks, and all their goods.

31:10 and they burnt all their citi wherein they dwelt, and all
their goodli castles, with fire.

31:11 and they took all the spoil, and all the prey, both of men and
of beasts.

31:12 and they brought the captives, and the prey, and the spoil, unto
moses, and eleazar the priest, and unto the congreg of the
children of israel, unto the camp at the plain of moab, which are by
jordan near jericho.

31:13 and moses, and eleazar the priest, and all the princ of the
congregation, went forth to meet them without the camp.

31:14 and mose wa wroth with the offic of the host, with the
captain over thousands, and captain over hundreds, which came from
th battle.

31:15 and mose said unto them, have ye save all the women alive?
31:16 behold, these caus the children of israel, through the counsel
of balaam, to commit trespass against the lord in the matter of peor,
and there wa a plagu among the congreg of the lord.

31:17 now therefor kill everi male among the littl ones, and kill
everi woman that hath known man by lie with him.

31:18 but all the women children, that have not known a man by lying
with him, keep aliv for yourselves.

31:19 and do ye abid without the camp seven days: whosoev hath
kil ani person, and whosoev hath touch ani slain, purifi both
yourselv and your captiv on the third day, and on the seventh day.

31:20 and purifi all your raiment, and all that is made of skins, and
al work of goats' hair, and all thing made of wood.

31:21 and eleazar the priest said unto the men of war which went to
th battle, thi is the ordin of the law which the lord commanded
moses; 31:22 onli the gold, and the silver, the brass, the iron, the
tin, and the lead, 31:23 everi thing that may abid the fire, ye shall
mak it go through the fire, and it shall be clean: nevertheless it
shal be purifi with the water of separation: and all that abideth
not the fire ye shall make go through the water.

31:24 and ye shall wash your cloth on the seventh day, and ye shall
b clean, and afterward ye shall come into the camp.

31:25 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 31:26 take the sum of the
prey that wa taken, both of man and of beast, thou, and eleazar the
priest, and the chief father of the congregation: 31:27 and divide
th prey into two parts; between them that took the war upon them, who
went out to battle, and between all the congregation: 31:28 and levi a
tribut unto the lord of the men of war which went out to battle: one
soul of five hundred, both of the persons, and of the beeves, and of
th asses, and of the sheep: 31:29 take it of their half, and give it
unto eleazar the priest, for an heav offer of the lord.

31:30 and of the children of israel' half, thou shalt take one
port of fifty, of the persons, of the beeves, of the asses, and of
th flocks, of all manner of beasts, and give them unto the levites,
which keep the charg of the tabernacl of the lord.

31:31 and mose and eleazar the priest did as the lord commanded
moses.

31:32 and the booty, be the rest of the prey which the men of war
had caught, wa six hundr thousand and seventi thousand and five
thousand sheep, 31:33 and threescor and twelv thousand beeves, 31:34
and threescor and one thousand asses, 31:35 and thirti and two
thousand person in all, of women that had not known man by lie with
him.

31:36 and the half, which wa the portion of them that went out to
war, wa in number three hundr thousand and seven and thirty
thousand and five hundr sheep: 31:37 and the lord' tribut of the
sheep wa six hundr and threescor and fifteen.

31:38 and the beev were thirti and six thousand; of which the lord's
tribut wa threescor and twelve.

31:39 and the ass were thirti thousand and five hundred; of which
th lord' tribut wa threescor and one.

31:40 and the person were sixteen thousand; of which the lord's
tribut wa thirti and two persons.

31:41 and mose gave the tribute, which wa the lord' heav offering,
unto eleazar the priest, as the lord command moses.

31:42 and of the children of israel' half, which mose divid from
th men that warred, 31:43 (now the half that pertain unto the
congreg wa three hundr thousand and thirti thousand and seven
thousand and five hundr sheep, 31:44 and thirti and six thousand
beeves, 31:45 and thirti thousand ass and five hundred, 31:46 and
sixteen thousand persons;) 31:47 even of the children of israel's
half, mose took one portion of fifty, both of man and of beast, and
gav them unto the levites, which kept the charg of the tabernacl of
th lord; as the lord command moses.

31:48 and the offic which were over thousand of the host, the
captain of thousands, and captain of hundreds, came near unto moses:
31:49 and they said unto moses, thi servant have taken the sum of the
men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man
of us.

31:50 We have therefor brought an oblat for the lord, what every
man hath gotten, of jewel of gold, chains, and bracelets, rings,
earrings, and tablets, to make an aton for our soul befor the
lord.

31:51 and mose and eleazar the priest took the gold of them, even all
wrought jewels.

31:52 and all the gold of the offer that they offer up to the
lord, of the captain of thousands, and of the captain of hundreds,
wa sixteen thousand seven hundr and fifti shekels.

31:53 (for the men of war had taken spoil, everi man for himself.)
31:54 and mose and eleazar the priest took the gold of the captains
of thousand and of hundreds, and brought it into the tabernacl of
th congregation, for a memori for the children of israel befor the
lord.

32:1 now the children of reuben and the children of gad had a very
great multitud of cattle: and when they saw the land of jazer, and
th land of gilead, that, behold, the place wa a place for cattle;
32:2 the children of gad and the children of reuben came and spake
unto moses, and to eleazar the priest, and unto the princ of the
congregation, saying, 32:3 ataroth, and dibon, and jazer, and nimrah,
and heshbon, and elealeh, and shebam, and nebo, and beon, 32:4 even
th countri which the lord smote befor the congreg of israel, is
a land for cattle, and thi servant have cattle: 32:5 wherefore, said
they, if we have found grace in thi sight, let thi land be given unto
thi servant for a possession, and bring us not over jordan.

32:6 and mose said unto the children of gad and to the children of
reuben, shall your brethren go to war, and shall ye sit here?  32:7
and wherefor discourag ye the heart of the children of israel from
go over into the land which the lord hath given them?  32:8 thus
did your fathers, when I sent them from kadeshbarnea to see the land.

32:9 for when they went up unto the valley of eshcol, and saw the
land, they discourag the heart of the children of israel, that they
should not go into the land which the lord had given them.

32:10 and the lord' anger wa kindl the same time, and he sware,
saying, 32:11 sure none of the men that came up out of egypt, from
twenti year old and upward, shall see the land which I sware unto
abraham, unto isaac, and unto jacob; becaus they have not wholly
follow me: 32:12 save caleb the son of jephunneh the kenezite, and
joshua the son of nun: for they have wholli follow the lord.

32:13 and the lord' anger wa kindl against israel, and he made
them wander in the wilder forti years, until all the generation,
that had done evil in the sight of the lord, wa consumed.

32:14 and, behold, ye are risen up in your fathers' stead, an increase
of sin men, to augment yet the fierc anger of the lord toward
israel.

32:15 for if ye turn away from after him, he will yet again leav them
in the wilderness; and ye shall destroy all thi people.

32:16 and they came near unto him, and said, We will build sheepfolds
her for our cattle, and citi for our littl ones: 32:17 but we
ourselv will go readi arm befor the children of israel, until we
hav brought them unto their place: and our littl one shall dwell in
th fenc citi becaus of the inhabit of the land.

32:18 We will not return unto our houses, until the children of israel
hav inherit everi man hi inheritance.

32:19 for we will not inherit with them on yonder side jordan, or
forward; becaus our inherit is fallen to us on thi side jordan
eastward.

32:20 and mose said unto them, If ye will do thi thing, if ye will
go arm befor the lord to war, 32:21 and will go all of you armed
ov jordan befor the lord, until he hath driven out hi enemi from
befor him, 32:22 and the land be subdu befor the lord: then
afterward ye shall return, and be guiltless befor the lord, and
befor israel; and thi land shall be your possess befor the lord.

32:23 but if ye will not do so, behold, ye have sin against the
lord: and be sure your sin will find you out.

32:24 build you citi for your littl ones, and fold for your sheep;
and do that which hath proceed out of your mouth.

32:25 and the children of gad and the children of reuben spake unto
moses, saying, thi servant will do as my lord commandeth.

32:26 our littl ones, our wives, our flocks, and all our cattle,
shal be there in the citi of gilead: 32:27 but thi servant will
pass over, everi man arm for war, befor the lord to battle, as my
lord saith.

32:28 So concern them mose command eleazar the priest, and
joshua the son of nun, and the chief father of the tribe of the
children of israel: 32:29 and mose said unto them, If the children of
gad and the children of reuben will pass with you over jordan, every
man arm to battle, befor the lord, and the land shall be subdued
befor you; then ye shall give them the land of gilead for a
possession: 32:30 but if they will not pass over with you armed, they
shal have possess among you in the land of canaan.

32:31 and the children of gad and the children of reuben answered,
saying, As the lord hath said unto thi servants, so will we do.

32:32 We will pass over arm befor the lord into the land of canaan,
that the possess of our inherit on thi side jordan may be
ours.

32:33 and mose gave unto them, even to the children of gad, and to
th children of reuben, and unto half the tribe of manasseh the son of
joseph, the kingdom of sihon king of the amorites, and the kingdom of
og king of bashan, the land, with the citi thereof in the coasts,
even the citi of the countri round about.

32:34 and the children of gad built dibon, and ataroth, and aroer,
32:35 and atroth, shophan, and jaazer, and jogbehah, 32:36 and
bethnimrah, and bethharan, fenc cities: and fold for sheep.

32:37 and the children of reuben built heshbon, and elealeh, and
kirjathaim, 32:38 and nebo, and baalmeon, (their name be changed,)
and shibmah: and gave other name unto the citi which they builded.

32:39 and the children of machir the son of manasseh went to gilead,
and took it, and dispossess the amorit which wa in it.

32:40 and mose gave gilead unto machir the son of manasseh; and he
dwelt therein.

32:41 and jair the son of manasseh went and took the small towns
thereof, and call them havothjair.

32:42 and nobah went and took kenath, and the villag thereof, and
cal it nobah, after hi own name.

33:1 these are the journey of the children of israel, which went
forth out of the land of egypt with their armi under the hand of
mos and aaron.

33:2 and mose wrote their go out accord to their journey by
th command of the lord: and these are their journey accord to
their go out.

33:3 and they depart from rames in the first month, on the
fifteenth day of the first month; on the morrow after the passov the
children of israel went out with an high hand in the sight of all the
egyptians.

33:4 for the egyptian buri all their firstborn, which the lord had
smitten among them: upon their god also the lord execut judgments.

33:5 and the children of israel remov from rameses, and pitch in
succoth.

33:6 and they depart from succoth, and pitch in etham, which is in
th edg of the wilderness.

33:7 and they remov from etham, and turn again unto pihahiroth,
which is befor baalzephon: and they pitch befor migdol.

33:8 and they depart from befor pihahiroth, and pass through the
midst of the sea into the wilderness, and went three days' journey in
th wilder of etham, and pitch in marah.

33:9 and they remov from marah, and came unto elim: and in elim were
twelv fountain of water, and threescor and ten palm trees; and they
pitch there.

33:10 and they remov from elim, and encamp by the red sea.

33:11 and they remov from the red sea, and encamp in the
wild of sin.

33:12 and they took their journey out of the wilder of sin, and
encamp in dophkah.

33:13 and they depart from dophkah, and encamp in alush.

33:14 and they remov from alush, and encamp at rephidim, where was
no water for the peopl to drink.

33:15 and they depart from rephidim, and pitch in the wilderness
of sinai.

33:16 and they remov from the desert of sinai, and pitch at
kibrothhattaavah.

33:17 and they depart from kibrothhattaavah, and encamp at
hazeroth.

33:18 and they depart from hazeroth, and pitch in rithmah.

33:19 and they depart from rithmah, and pitch at rimmonparez.

33:20 and they depart from rimmonparez, and pitch in libnah.

33:21 and they remov from libnah, and pitch at rissah.

33:22 and they journey from rissah, and pitch in kehelathah.

33:23 and they went from kehelathah, and pitch in mount shapher.

33:24 and they remov from mount shapher, and encamp in haradah.

33:25 and they remov from haradah, and pitch in makheloth.

33:26 and they remov from makheloth, and encamp at tahath.

33:27 and they depart from tahath, and pitch at tarah.

33:28 and they remov from tarah, and pitch in mithcah.

33:29 and they went from mithcah, and pitch in hashmonah.

33:30 and they depart from hashmonah, and encamp at moseroth.

33:31 and they depart from moseroth, and pitch in benejaakan.

33:32 and they remov from benejaakan, and encamp at horhagidgad.

33:33 and they went from horhagidgad, and pitch in jotbathah.

33:34 and they remov from jotbathah, and encamp at ebronah.

33:35 and they depart from ebronah, and encamp at eziongaber.

33:36 and they remov from eziongaber, and pitch in the wilderness
of zin, which is kadesh.

33:37 and they remov from kadesh, and pitch in mount hor, in the
edg of the land of edom.

33:38 and aaron the priest went up into mount hor at the commandment
of the lord, and die there, in the fortieth year after the children
of israel were come out of the land of egypt, in the first day of the
fifth month.

33:39 and aaron wa an hundr and twenti and three year old when he
di in mount hor.

33:40 and king arad the canaanite, which dwelt in the south in the
land of canaan, heard of the come of the children of israel.

33:41 and they depart from mount hor, and pitch in zalmonah.

33:42 and they depart from zalmonah, and pitch in punon.

33:43 and they depart from punon, and pitch in oboth.

33:44 and they depart from oboth, and pitch in ijeabarim, in the
bord of moab.

33:45 and they depart from iim, and pitch in dibongad.

33:46 and they remov from dibongad, and encamp in almondiblathaim.

33:47 and they remov from almondiblathaim, and pitch in the
mountain of abarim, befor nebo.

33:48 and they depart from the mountain of abarim, and pitch in
th plain of moab by jordan near jericho.

33:49 and they pitch by jordan, from bethjesimoth even unto
abelshittim in the plain of moab.

33:50 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan
near jericho, saying, 33:51 speak unto the children of israel, and say
unto them, when ye are pass over jordan into the land of canaan;
33:52 then ye shall drive out all the inhabit of the land from
befor you, and destroy all their pictures, and destroy all their
molten images, and quit pluck down all their high places: 33:53 and
y shall dispossess the inhabit of the land, and dwell therein:
for I have given you the land to possess it.

33:54 and ye shall divid the land by lot for an inherit among
your families: and to the more ye shall give the more inheritance, and
to the fewer ye shall give the less inheritance: everi man's
inherit shall be in the place where hi lot falleth; accord to
th tribe of your father ye shall inherit.

33:55 but if ye will not drive out the inhabit of the land from
befor you; then it shall come to pass, that those which ye let remain
of them shall be prick in your eyes, and thorn in your sides, and
shal vex you in the land wherein ye dwell.

33:56 moreov it shall come to pass, that I shall do unto you, as i
thought to do unto them.

34:1 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 34:2 command the children
of israel, and say unto them, when ye come into the land of canaan;
(thi is the land that shall fall unto you for an inheritance, even
th land of canaan with the coast thereof:) 34:3 then your south
quart shall be from the wilder of zin along by the coast of
edom, and your south border shall be the outmost coast of the salt sea
eastward: 34:4 and your border shall turn from the south to the ascent
of akrabbim, and pass on to zin: and the go forth thereof shall be
from the south to kadeshbarnea, and shall go on to hazaraddar, and
pass on to azmon: 34:5 and the border shall fetch a compass from azmon
unto the river of egypt, and the go out of it shall be at the sea.

34:6 and as for the western border, ye shall even have the great sea
for a border: thi shall be your west border.

34:7 and thi shall be your north border: from the great sea ye shall
point out for you mount hor: 34:8 from mount hor ye shall point out
your border unto the entranc of hamath; and the go forth of the
bord shall be to zedad: 34:9 and the border shall go on to ziphron,
and the go out of it shall be at hazarenan: thi shall be your
north border.

34:10 and ye shall point out your east border from hazarenan to
shepham: 34:11 and the coast shall go down from shepham to riblah, on
th east side of ain; and the border shall descend, and shall reach
unto the side of the sea of chinnereth eastward: 34:12 and the border
shal go down to jordan, and the go out of it shall be at the salt
sea: thi shall be your land with the coast thereof round about.

34:13 and mose command the children of israel, saying, thi is the
land which ye shall inherit by lot, which the lord command to give
unto the nine tribes, and to the half tribe: 34:14 for the tribe of
th children of reuben accord to the hous of their fathers, and
th tribe of the children of gad accord to the hous of their
fathers, have receiv their inheritance; and half the tribe of
manasseh have receiv their inheritance: 34:15 the two tribe and the
half tribe have receiv their inherit on thi side jordan near
jericho eastward, toward the sunrising.

34:16 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 34:17 these are the names
of the men which shall divid the land unto you: eleazar the priest,
and joshua the son of nun.

34:18 and ye shall take one princ of everi tribe, to divid the land
bi inheritance.

34:19 and the name of the men are these: Of the tribe of judah, caleb
th son of jephunneh.

34:20 and of the tribe of the children of simeon, shemuel the son of
ammihud.

34:21 Of the tribe of benjamin, elidad the son of chislon.

34:22 and the princ of the tribe of the children of dan, bukki the
son of jogli.

34:23 the princ of the children of joseph, for the tribe of the
children of manasseh, hanniel the son of ephod.

34:24 and the princ of the tribe of the children of ephraim, kemuel
th son of shiphtan.

34:25 and the princ of the tribe of the children of zebulun,
elizaphan the son of parnach.

34:26 and the princ of the tribe of the children of issachar, paltiel
th son of azzan.

34:27 and the princ of the tribe of the children of asher, ahihud the
son of shelomi.

34:28 and the princ of the tribe of the children of naphtali, pedahel
th son of ammihud.

34:29 these are they whom the lord command to divid the inheritance
unto the children of israel in the land of canaan.

35:1 and the lord spake unto mose in the plain of moab by jordan
near jericho, saying, 35:2 command the children of israel, that they
giv unto the levit of the inherit of their possess citi to
dwel in; and ye shall give also unto the levit suburb for the
citi round about them.

35:3 and the citi shall they have to dwell in; and the suburb of
them shall be for their cattle, and for their goods, and for all their
beasts.

35:4 and the suburb of the cities, which ye shall give unto the
levites, shall reach from the wall of the citi and outward a thousand
cubit round about.

35:5 and ye shall measur from without the citi on the east side two
thousand cubits, and on the south side two thousand cubits, and on the
west side two thousand cubits, and on the north side two thousand
cubits; and the citi shall be in the midst: thi shall be to them the
suburb of the cities.

35:6 and among the citi which ye shall give unto the levit there
shal be six citi for refuge, which ye shall appoint for the
manslayer, that he may flee thither: and to them ye shall add forty
and two cities.

35:7 So all the citi which ye shall give to the levit shall be
forti and eight cities: them shall ye give with their suburbs.

35:8 and the citi which ye shall give shall be of the possess of
th children of israel: from them that have mani ye shall give many;
but from them that have few ye shall give few: everi one shall give of
hi citi unto the levit accord to hi inherit which he
inheriteth.

35:9 and the lord spake unto moses, saying, 35:10 speak unto the
children of israel, and say unto them, when ye be come over jordan
into the land of canaan; 35:11 then ye shall appoint you citi to be
citi of refug for you; that the slayer may flee thither, which
killeth ani person at unawares.

35:12 and they shall be unto you citi for refug from the avenger;
that the manslay die not, until he stand befor the congreg in
judgment.

35:13 and of these citi which ye shall give six citi shall ye have
for refuge.

35:14 Ye shall give three citi on thi side jordan, and three cities
shal ye give in the land of canaan, which shall be citi of refuge.

35:15 these six citi shall be a refuge, both for the children of
israel, and for the stranger, and for the sojourn among them: that
everi one that killeth ani person unawar may flee thither.

35:16 and if he smite him with an instrument of iron, so that he die,
h is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to death.

35:17 and if he smite him with throw a stone, wherewith he may die,
and he die, he is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to
death.

35:18 Or if he smite him with an hand weapon of wood, wherewith he may
die, and he die, he is a murderer: the murder shall sure be put to
death.

35:19 the reveng of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he
meeteth him, he shall slay him.

35:20 but if he thrust him of hatred, or hurl at him by lay of
wait, that he die; 35:21 Or in enmiti smite him with hi hand, that he
die: he that smote him shall sure be put to death; for he is a
murderer: the reveng of blood shall slay the murderer, when he
meeteth him.

35:22 but if he thrust him suddenli without enmity, or have cast upon
him ani thing without lay of wait, 35:23 Or with ani stone,
wherewith a man may die, see him not, and cast it upon him, that he
die, and wa not hi enemy, neither sought hi harm: 35:24 then the
congreg shall judg between the slayer and the reveng of blood
accord to these judgments: 35:25 and the congreg shall deliver
th slayer out of the hand of the reveng of blood, and the
congreg shall restor him to the citi of hi refuge, whither he
wa fled: and he shall abid in it unto the death of the high priest,
which wa anoint with the holi oil.

35:26 but if the slayer shall at ani time come without the border of
th citi of hi refuge, whither he wa fled; 35:27 and the reveng of
blood find him without the border of the citi of hi refuge, and the
reveng of blood kill the slayer; he shall not be guilti of blood:
35:28 becaus he should have remain in the citi of hi refug until
th death of the high priest: but after the death of the high priest
th slayer shall return into the land of hi possession.

35:29 So these thing shall be for a statut of judgment unto you
throughout your gener in all your dwellings.

35:30 whoso killeth ani person, the murder shall be put to death by
th mouth of witnesses: but one wit shall not testifi against any
person to caus him to die.

35:31 moreov ye shall take no satisfact for the life of a
murderer, which is guilti of death: but he shall be sure put to
death.

35:32 and ye shall take no satisfact for him that is fled to the
citi of hi refuge, that he should come again to dwell in the land,
until the death of the priest.

35:33 So ye shall not pollut the land wherein ye are: for blood it
defileth the land: and the land cannot be cleans of the blood that
i shed therein, but by the blood of him that shed it.

35:34 defil not therefor the land which ye shall inhabit, wherein i
dwell: for I the lord dwell among the children of israel.

36:1 and the chief father of the famili of the children of gilead,
th son of machir, the son of manasseh, of the famili of the son of
joseph, came near, and spake befor moses, and befor the princes, the
chief father of the children of israel: 36:2 and they said, the lord
command my lord to give the land for an inherit by lot to the
children of israel: and my lord wa command by the lord to give the
inherit of zelophehad our brother unto hi daughters.

36:3 and if they be marri to ani of the son of the other tribe of
th children of israel, then shall their inherit be taken from the
inherit of our fathers, and shall be put to the inherit of the
trib whereunto they are received: so shall it be taken from the lot
of our inheritance.

36:4 and when the jubil of the children of israel shall be, then
shal their inherit be put unto the inherit of the tribe
whereunto they are received: so shall their inherit be taken away
from the inherit of the tribe of our fathers.

36:5 and mose command the children of israel accord to the word
of the lord, saying, the tribe of the son of joseph hath said well.

36:6 thi is the thing which the lord doth command concern the
daught of zelophehad, saying, let them marri to whom they think
best; onli to the famili of the tribe of their father shall they
marry.

36:7 So shall not the inherit of the children of israel remove
from tribe to tribe: for everi one of the children of israel shall
keep himself to the inherit of the tribe of hi fathers.

36:8 and everi daughter, that possesseth an inherit in ani tribe
of the children of israel, shall be wife unto one of the famili of the
trib of her father, that the children of israel may enjoy everi man
th inherit of hi fathers.

36:9 neither shall the inherit remov from one tribe to another
tribe; but everi one of the tribe of the children of israel shall
keep himself to hi own inheritance.

36:10 even as the lord command moses, so did the daughter of
zelophehad: 36:11 for mahlah, tirzah, and hoglah, and milcah, and
noah, the daughter of zelophehad, were marri unto their father's
brothers' sons: 36:12 and they were marri into the famili of the
son of manasseh the son of joseph, and their inherit remain in
th tribe of the famili of their father.

36:13 these are the command and the judgments, which the lord
command by the hand of mose unto the children of israel in the
plain of moab by jordan near jericho.




th fifth book of moses:  call deuteronomy


1:1 these be the word which mose spake unto all israel on thi side
jordan in the wilderness, in the plain over against the red sea,
between paran, and tophel, and laban, and hazeroth, and dizahab.

1:2 (there are eleven days' journey from horeb by the way of mount
seir unto kadeshbarnea.)  1:3 and it came to pass in the fortieth
year, in the eleventh month, on the first day of the month, that moses
spak unto the children of israel, accord unto all that the lord
had given him in command unto them; 1:4 after he had slain sihon
th king of the amorites, which dwelt in heshbon, and Og the king of
bashan, which dwelt at astaroth in edrei: 1:5 On thi side jordan, in
th land of moab, began mose to declar thi law, saying, 1:6 the
lord our god spake unto us in horeb, saying, Ye have dwelt long enough
in thi mount: 1:7 turn you, and take your journey, and go to the
mount of the amorites, and unto all the place nigh thereunto, in the
plain, in the hills, and in the vale, and in the south, and by the sea
side, to the land of the canaanites, and unto lebanon, unto the great
river, the river euphrates.

1:8 behold, I have set the land befor you: go in and possess the land
which the lord sware unto your fathers, abraham, isaac, and jacob, to
giv unto them and to their seed after them.

1:9 and I spake unto you at that time, saying, I am not abl to bear
you myself alone: 1:10 the lord your god hath multipli you, and,
behold, ye are thi day as the star of heaven for multitude.

1:11 (the lord god of your father make you a thousand time so many
mor as ye are, and bless you, as he hath promis you!)  1:12 how can
i myself alon bear your cumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
1:13 take you wise men, and understanding, and known among your
tribes, and I will make them ruler over you.

1:14 and ye answer me, and said, the thing which thou hast spoken is
good for us to do.

1:15 So I took the chief of your tribes, wise men, and known, and made
them head over you, captain over thousands, and captain over
hundreds, and captain over fifties, and captain over tens, and
offic among your tribes.

1:16 and I charg your judg at that time, saying, hear the causes
between your brethren, and judg righteous between everi man and his
brother, and the stranger that is with him.

1:17 Ye shall not respect person in judgment; but ye shall hear the
smal as well as the great; ye shall not be afraid of the face of man;
for the judgment is god's: and the caus that is too hard for you,
br it unto me, and I will hear it.

1:18 and I command you at that time all the thing which ye should
do.

1:19 and when we depart from horeb, we went through all that great
and terribl wilderness, which ye saw by the way of the mountain of
th amorites, as the lord our god command us; and we came to
kadeshbarnea.

1:20 and I said unto you, Ye are come unto the mountain of the
amorites, which the lord our god doth give unto us.

1:21 behold, the lord thi god hath set the land befor thee: go up and
possess it, as the lord god of thi father hath said unto thee; fear
not, neither be discouraged.

1:22 and ye came near unto me everi one of you, and said, We will send
men befor us, and they shall search us out the land, and bring us
word again by what way we must go up, and into what citi we shall
come.

1:23 and the say pleas me well: and I took twelv men of you, one
of a tribe: 1:24 and they turn and went up into the mountain, and
cam unto the valley of eshcol, and search it out.

1:25 and they took of the fruit of the land in their hands, and
brought it down unto us, and brought us word again, and said, It is a
good land which the lord our god doth give us.

1:26 notwithstand ye would not go up, but rebel against the
command of the lord your god: 1:27 and ye murmur in your tents,
and said, becaus the lord hate us, he hath brought us forth out of
th land of egypt, to deliv us into the hand of the amorites, to
destroy us.

1:28 whither shall we go up? our brethren have discourag our heart,
saying, the peopl is greater and taller than we; the citi are great
and wall up to heaven; and moreov we have seen the son of the
anakim there.

1:29 then I said unto you, dread not, neither be afraid of them.

1:30 the lord your god which goeth befor you, he shall fight for you,
accord to all that he did for you in egypt befor your eyes; 1:31
and in the wilderness, where thou hast seen how that the lord thi god
bar thee, as a man doth bear hi son, in all the way that ye went,
until ye came into thi place.

1:32 yet in thi thing ye did not believ the lord your god, 1:33 who
went in the way befor you, to search you out a place to pitch your
tent in, in fire by night, to shew you by what way ye should go, and
in a cloud by day.

1:34 and the lord heard the voic of your words, and wa wroth, and
sware, saying, 1:35 sure there shall not one of these men of this
evil gener see that good land, which I sware to give unto your
fathers.

1:36 save caleb the son of jephunneh; he shall see it, and to him will
i give the land that he hath trodden upon, and to hi children,
becaus he hath wholli follow the lord.

1:37 also the lord wa angri with me for your sakes, saying, thou also
shalt not go in thither.

1:38 but joshua the son of nun, which standeth befor thee, he shall
go in thither: encourag him: for he shall caus israel to inherit it.

1:39 moreov your littl ones, which ye said should be a prey, and
your children, which in that day had no knowledg between good and
evil, they shall go in thither, and unto them will I give it, and they
shal possess it.

1:40 but as for you, turn you, and take your journey into the
wild by the way of the red sea.

1:41 then ye answer and said unto me, We have sin against the
lord, we will go up and fight, accord to all that the lord our god
command us.

and when ye had gird on everi man hi weapon of war, ye were ready
to go up into the hill.

1:42 and the lord said unto me, say unto them. Go not up, neither
fight; for I am not among you; lest ye be smitten befor your enemies.

1:43 So I spake unto you; and ye would not hear, but rebel against
th command of the lord, and went presumptu up into the hill.

1:44 and the amorites, which dwelt in that mountain, came out against
you, and chase you, as bee do, and destroy you in seir, even unto
hormah.

1:45 and ye return and wept befor the lord; but the lord would not
hearken to your voice, nor give ear unto you.

1:46 So ye abod in kadesh mani days, accord unto the day that ye
abod there.

2:1 then we turned, and took our journey into the wilder by the
way of the red sea, as the lord spake unto me: and we compass mount
seir mani days.

2:2 and the lord spake unto me, saying, 2:3 Ye have compass this
mountain long enough: turn you northward.

2:4 and command thou the people, saying, Ye are to pass through the
coast of your brethren the children of esau, which dwell in seir; and
they shall be afraid of you: take ye good heed unto yourselves
therefore: 2:5 meddl not with them; for I will not give you of their
land, no, not so much as a foot breadth; becaus I have given mount
seir unto esau for a possession.

2:6 Ye shall buy meat of them for money, that ye may eat; and ye shall
also buy water of them for money, that ye may drink.

2:7 for the lord thi god hath bless thee in all the work of thy
hand: he knoweth thi walk through thi great wilderness: these
forti year the lord thi god hath been with thee; thou hast lacked
nothing.

2:8 and when we pass by from our brethren the children of esau,
which dwelt in seir, through the way of the plain from elath, and from
eziongaber, we turn and pass by the way of the wilder of moab.

2:9 and the lord said unto me, distress not the moabites, neither
contend with them in battle: for I will not give thee of their land
for a possession; becaus I have given Ar unto the children of lot for
a possession.

2:10 the emim dwelt therein in time past, a peopl great, and many,
and tall, as the anakims; 2:11 which also were account giants, as
th anakims; but the moabit call them emims.

2:12 the horim also dwelt in seir beforetime; but the children of
esau succeed them, when they had destroy them from befor them,
and dwelt in their stead; as israel did unto the land of his
possession, which the lord gave unto them.

2:13 now rise up, said I, and get you over the brook zered. and we
went over the brook zered.

2:14 and the space in which we came from kadeshbarnea, until we were
com over the brook zered, wa thirti and eight years; until all the
gener of the men of war were wast out from among the host, as
th lord sware unto them.

2:15 for inde the hand of the lord wa against them, to destroy them
from among the host, until they were consumed.

2:16 So it came to pass, when all the men of war were consum and
dead from among the people, 2:17 that the lord spake unto me, saying,
2:18 thou art to pass over through ar, the coast of moab, thi day:
2:19 and when thou comest nigh over against the children of ammon,
distress them not, nor meddl with them: for I will not give thee of
th land of the children of ammon ani possession; becaus I have given
it unto the children of lot for a possession.

2:20 (that also wa account a land of giants: giant dwelt therein
in old time; and the ammonit call them zamzummims; 2:21 A people
great, and many, and tall, as the anakims; but the lord destroy them
befor them; and they succeed them, and dwelt in their stead: 2:22
a he did to the children of esau, which dwelt in seir, when he
destroy the horim from befor them; and they succeed them, and
dwelt in their stead even unto thi day: 2:23 and the avim which
dwelt in hazerim, even unto azzah, the caphtorims, which came forth
out of caphtor, destroy them, and dwelt in their stead.)  2:24 rise
y up, take your journey, and pass over the river arnon: behold, i
hav given into thine hand sihon the amorite, king of heshbon, and his
land: begin to possess it, and contend with him in battle.

2:25 thi day will I begin to put the dread of thee and the fear of
the upon the nation that are under the whole heaven, who shall hear
report of thee, and shall tremble, and be in anguish becaus of thee.

2:26 and I sent messeng out of the wilder of kedemoth unto
sihon king of heshbon with word of peace, saying, 2:27 let me pass
through thi land: I will go along by the high way, I will neither turn
unto the right hand nor to the left.

2:28 thou shalt sell me meat for money, that I may eat; and give me
wat for money, that I may drink: onli I will pass through on my
feet; 2:29 (a the children of esau which dwell in seir, and the
moabit which dwell in ar, did unto me;) until I shall pass over
jordan into the land which the lord our god giveth us.

2:30 but sihon king of heshbon would not let us pass by him: for the
lord thi god harden hi spirit, and made hi heart obstinate, that
h might deliv him into thi hand, as appeareth thi day.

2:31 and the lord said unto me, behold, I have begun to give sihon and
hi land befor thee: begin to possess, that thou mayest inherit his
land.

2:32 then sihon came out against us, he and all hi people, to fight
at jahaz.

2:33 and the lord our god deliv him befor us; and we smote him,
and hi sons, and all hi people.

2:34 and we took all hi citi at that time, and utterli destroyed
th men, and the women, and the littl ones, of everi city, we left
non to remain: 2:35 onli the cattl we took for a prey unto
ourselves, and the spoil of the citi which we took.

2:36 from aroer, which is by the brink of the river of arnon, and from
th citi that is by the river, even unto gilead, there wa not one
c too strong for us: the lord our god deliv all unto us: 2:37
onli unto the land of the children of ammon thou camest not, nor unto
ani place of the river jabbok, nor unto the citi in the mountains,
nor unto whatsoev the lord our god forbad us.

3:1 then we turned, and went up the way to bashan: and Og the king of
bashan came out against us, he and all hi people, to battl at edrei.

3:2 and the lord said unto me, fear him not: for I will deliv him,
and all hi people, and hi land, into thi hand; and thou shalt do
unto him as thou didst unto sihon king of the amorites, which dwelt at
heshbon.

3:3 So the lord our god deliv into our hand Og also, the king of
bashan, and all hi people: and we smote him until none wa left to
him remaining.

3:4 and we took all hi citi at that time, there wa not a city
which we took not from them, threescor cities, all the region of
argob, the kingdom of Og in bashan.

3:5 all these citi were fenc with high walls, gates, and bars;
besid unwal town a great many.

3:6 and we utterli destroy them, as we did unto sihon king of
heshbon, utterli destroy the men, women, and children, of every
city.

3:7 but all the cattle, and the spoil of the cities, we took for a
prey to ourselves.

3:8 and we took at that time out of the hand of the two king of the
amorit the land that wa on thi side jordan, from the river of
arnon unto mount hermon; 3:9 (which hermon the sidonian call sirion;
and the amorit call it shenir;) 3:10 all the citi of the plain,
and all gilead, and all bashan, unto salchah and edrei, citi of the
kingdom of Og in bashan.

3:11 for onli Og king of bashan remain of the remnant of giants;
behold hi bedstead wa a bedstead of iron; is it not in rabbath of
th children of ammon? nine cubit wa the length thereof, and four
cubit the breadth of it, after the cubit of a man.

3:12 and thi land, which we possess at that time, from aroer, which
i by the river arnon, and half mount gilead, and the citi thereof,
gav I unto the reubenit and to the gadites.

3:13 and the rest of gilead, and all bashan, be the kingdom of og,
gav I unto the half tribe of manasseh; all the region of argob, with
al bashan, which wa call the land of giants.

3:14 jair the son of manasseh took all the countri of argob unto the
coast of geshuri and maachathi; and call them after hi own name,
bashanhavothjair, unto thi day.

3:15 and I gave gilead unto machir.

3:16 and unto the reubenit and unto the gadit I gave from gilead
even unto the river arnon half the valley, and the border even unto
th river jabbok, which is the border of the children of ammon; 3:17
the plain also, and jordan, and the coast thereof, from chinnereth
even unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea, under ashdothpisgah
eastward.

3:18 and I command you at that time, saying, the lord your god hath
given you thi land to possess it: ye shall pass over arm before
your brethren the children of israel, all that are meet for the war.

3:19 but your wives, and your littl ones, and your cattle, (for i
know that ye have much cattle,) shall abid in your citi which i
hav given you; 3:20 until the lord have given rest unto your
brethren, as well as unto you, and until they also possess the land
which the lord your god hath given them beyond jordan: and then shall
y return everi man unto hi possession, which I have given you.

3:21 and I command joshua at that time, saying, thine eye have seen
al that the lord your god hath done unto these two kings: so shall
th lord do unto all the kingdom whither thou passest.

3:22 Ye shall not fear them: for the lord your god he shall fight for
you.

3:23 and I besought the lord at that time, saying, 3:24 O lord god,
thou hast begun to shew thi servant thi greatness, and thi mighty
hand: for what god is there in heaven or in earth, that can do
accord to thi works, and accord to thi might?  3:25 I pray thee,
let me go over, and see the good land that is beyond jordan, that
goodli mountain, and lebanon.

3:26 but the lord wa wroth with me for your sakes, and would not hear
me: and the lord said unto me, let it suffic thee; speak no more unto
m of thi matter.

3:27 get thee up into the top of pisgah, and lift up thine eyes
westward, and northward, and southward, and eastward, and behold it
with thine eyes: for thou shalt not go over thi jordan.

3:28 but charg joshua, and encourag him, and strengthen him: for he
shal go over befor thi people, and he shall caus them to inherit
th land which thou shalt see.

3:29 So we abod in the valley over against bethpeor.

4:1 now therefor hearken, O israel, unto the statut and unto the
judgments, which I teach you, for to do them, that ye may live, and go
in and possess the land which the lord god of your father giveth you.

4:2 Ye shall not add unto the word which I command you, neither shall
y diminish ought from it, that ye may keep the command of the
lord your god which I command you.

4:3 your eye have seen what the lord did becaus of baalpeor: for all
th men that follow baalpeor, the lord thi god hath destroy them
from among you.

4:4 but ye that did cleav unto the lord your god are aliv everi one
of you thi day.

4:5 behold, I have taught you statut and judgments, even as the lord
mi god command me, that ye should do so in the land whither ye go to
possess it.

4:6 keep therefor and do them; for thi is your wisdom and your
understand in the sight of the nations, which shall hear all these
statutes, and say, sure thi great nation is a wise and
understand people.

4:7 for what nation is there so great, who hath god so nigh unto them,
a the lord our god is in all thing that we call upon him for?  4:8
and what nation is there so great, that hath statut and judgment so
right as all thi law, which I set befor you thi day?  4:9 only
tak heed to thyself, and keep thi soul diligently, lest thou forget
th thing which thine eye have seen, and lest they depart from thy
heart all the day of thi life: but teach them thi sons, and thi sons'
sons; 4:10 special the day that thou stoodest befor the lord thy
god in horeb, when the lord said unto me, gather me the people
together, and I will make them hear my words, that they may learn to
fear me all the day that they shall live upon the earth, and that
they may teach their children.

4:11 and ye came near and stood under the mountain; and the mountain
burn with fire unto the midst of heaven, with darkness, clouds, and
thick darkness.

4:12 and the lord spake unto you out of the midst of the fire: ye
heard the voic of the words, but saw no similitude; onli ye heard a
voice.

4:13 and he declar unto you hi covenant, which he command you to
perform, even ten commandments; and he wrote them upon two tabl of
stone.

4:14 and the lord command me at that time to teach you statut and
judgments, that ye might do them in the land whither ye go over to
possess it.

4:15 take ye therefor good heed unto yourselves; for ye saw no manner
of similitud on the day that the lord spake unto you in horeb out of
th midst of the fire: 4:16 lest ye corrupt yourselves, and make you a
graven image, the similitud of ani figure, the like of male or
female, 4:17 the like of ani beast that is on the earth, the
lik of ani wing fowl that flieth in the air, 4:18 the likeness
of ani thing that creepeth on the ground, the like of ani fish
that is in the water beneath the earth: 4:19 and lest thou lift up
thin eye unto heaven, and when thou seest the sun, and the moon, and
th stars, even all the host of heaven, shouldest be driven to worship
them, and serv them, which the lord thi god hath divid unto all
nat under the whole heaven.

4:20 but the lord hath taken you, and brought you forth out of the
iron furnace, even out of egypt, to be unto him a peopl of
inheritance, as ye are thi day.

4:21 furthermor the lord wa angri with me for your sakes, and sware
that I should not go over jordan, and that I should not go in unto
that good land, which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance:
4:22 but I must die in thi land, I must not go over jordan: but ye
shal go over, and possess that good land.

4:23 take heed unto yourselves, lest ye forget the coven of the
lord your god, which he made with you, and make you a graven image, or
th like of ani thing, which the lord thi god hath forbidden thee.

4:24 for the lord thi god is a consum fire, even a jealou god.

4:25 when thou shalt beget children, and children' children, and ye
shal have remain long in the land, and shall corrupt yourselves,
and make a graven image, or the like of ani thing, and shall do
evil in the sight of the lord thi god, to provok him to anger: 4:26 i
cal heaven and earth to wit against you thi day, that ye shall
soon utterli perish from off the land whereunto ye go over jordan to
possess it; ye shall not prolong your day upon it, but shall utterly
b destroyed.

4:27 and the lord shall scatter you among the nations, and ye shall be
left few in number among the heathen, whither the lord shall lead you.

4:28 and there ye shall serv gods, the work of men' hands, wood and
stone, which neither see, nor hear, nor eat, nor smell.

4:29 but if from thenc thou shalt seek the lord thi god, thou shalt
find him, if thou seek him with all thi heart and with all thi soul.

4:30 when thou art in tribulation, and all these thing are come upon
thee, even in the latter days, if thou turn to the lord thi god, and
shalt be obedi unto hi voice; 4:31 (for the lord thi god is a
merci god;) he will not forsak thee, neither destroy thee, nor
forget the coven of thi father which he sware unto them.

4:32 for ask now of the day that are past, which were befor thee,
sinc the day that god creat man upon the earth, and ask from the
on side of heaven unto the other, whether there hath been ani such
th as thi great thing is, or hath been heard like it?  4:33 did
ev peopl hear the voic of god speak out of the midst of the
fire, as thou hast heard, and live?  4:34 Or hath god assay to go
and take him a nation from the midst of anoth nation, by
temptations, by signs, and by wonders, and by war, and by a mighty
hand, and by a stretch out arm, and by great terrors, accord to
al that the lord your god did for you in egypt befor your eyes?
4:35 unto thee it wa shewed, that thou mightest know that the lord he
i god; there is none els besid him.

4:36 out of heaven he made thee to hear hi voice, that he might
instruct thee: and upon earth he shew thee hi great fire; and thou
heardest hi word out of the midst of the fire.

4:37 and becaus he love thi fathers, therefor he chose their seed
aft them, and brought thee out in hi sight with hi mighti power
out of egypt; 4:38 To drive out nation from befor thee greater and
mighti than thou art, to bring thee in, to give thee their land for
an inheritance, as it is thi day.

4:39 know therefor thi day, and consid it in thine heart, that the
lord he is god in heaven above, and upon the earth beneath: there is
non else.

4:40 thou shalt keep therefor hi statutes, and hi commandments,
which I command thee thi day, that it may go well with thee, and with
thi children after thee, and that thou mayest prolong thi day upon
th earth, which the lord thi god giveth thee, for ever.

4:41 then mose sever three citi on thi side jordan toward the
sunrising; 4:42 that the slayer might flee thither, which should kill
hi neighbour unawares, and hate him not in time past; and that
fle unto one of these citi he might live: 4:43 namely, bezer in
th wilderness, in the plain country, of the reubenites; and ramoth in
gilead, of the gadites; and golan in bashan, of the manassites.

4:44 and thi is the law which mose set befor the children of
israel: 4:45 these are the testimonies, and the statutes, and the
judgments, which mose spake unto the children of israel, after they
cam forth out of egypt.

4:46 On thi side jordan, in the valley over against bethpeor, in the
land of sihon king of the amorites, who dwelt at heshbon, whom moses
and the children of israel smote, after they were come forth out of
egypt: 4:47 and they possess hi land, and the land of Og king of
bashan, two king of the amorites, which were on thi side jordan
toward the sunrising; 4:48 from aroer, which is by the bank of the
riv arnon, even unto mount sion, which is hermon, 4:49 and all the
plain on thi side jordan eastward, even unto the sea of the plain,
und the spring of pisgah.

5:1 and mose call all israel, and said unto them, hear, O israel,
th statut and judgment which I speak in your ear thi day, that
y may learn them, and keep, and do them.

5:2 the lord our god made a coven with us in horeb.

5:3 the lord made not thi coven with our fathers, but with us,
even us, who are all of us here aliv thi day.

5:4 the lord talk with you face to face in the mount out of the
midst of the fire, 5:5 (I stood between the lord and you at that time,
to shew you the word of the lord: for ye were afraid by reason of the
fire, and went not up into the mount;) saying, 5:6 I am the lord thy
god, which brought thee out of the land of egypt, from the hous of
bondage.

5:7 thou shalt have none other god befor me.

5:8 thou shalt not make thee ani graven image, or ani like of any
th that is in heaven above, or that is in the earth beneath, or
that is in the water beneath the earth: 5:9 thou shalt not bow down
thyself unto them, nor serv them: for I the lord thi god am a jealous
god, visit the iniqu of the father upon the children unto the
third and fourth gener of them that hate me, 5:10 and shewing
merci unto thousand of them that love me and keep my commandments.

5:11 thou shalt not take the name of the lord thi god in vain: for the
lord will not hold him guiltless that taketh hi name in vain.

5:12 keep the sabbath day to sanctifi it, as the lord thi god hath
command thee.

5:13 six day thou shalt labour, and do all thi work: 5:14 but the
seventh day is the sabbath of the lord thi god: in it thou shalt not
do ani work, thou, nor thi son, nor thi daughter, nor thi manservant,
nor thi maidservant, nor thine ox, nor thine ass, nor ani of thy
cattle, nor thi stranger that is within thi gates; that thi manservant
and thi maidserv may rest as well as thou.

5:15 and rememb that thou wast a servant in the land of egypt, and
that the lord thi god brought thee out thenc through a mighti hand
and by a stretch out arm: therefor the lord thi god command thee
to keep the sabbath day.

5:16 honour thi father and thi mother, as the lord thi god hath
command thee; that thi day may be prolonged, and that it may go
wel with thee, in the land which the lord thi god giveth thee.

5:17 thou shalt not kill.

5:18 neither shalt thou commit adultery.

5:19 neither shalt thou steal.

5:20 neither shalt thou bear fals wit against thi neighbour.

5:21 neither shalt thou desir thi neighbour' wife, neither shalt
thou covet thi neighbour' house, hi field, or hi manservant, or his
maidservant, hi ox, or hi ass, or ani thing that is thi neighbour's.

5:22 these word the lord spake unto all your assembl in the mount
out of the midst of the fire, of the cloud, and of the thick darkness,
with a great voice: and he ad no more. and he wrote them in two
tabl of stone, and deliv them unto me.

5:23 and it came to pass, when ye heard the voic out of the midst of
th darkness, (for the mountain did burn with fire,) that ye came near
unto me, even all the head of your tribes, and your elders; 5:24 and
y said, behold, the lord our god hath shew us hi glori and his
greatness, and we have heard hi voic out of the midst of the fire:
w have seen thi day that god doth talk with man, and he liveth.

5:25 now therefor whi should we die? for thi great fire will consume
us: if we hear the voic of the lord our god ani more, then we shall
die.

5:26 for who is there of all flesh, that hath heard the voic of the
liv god speak out of the midst of the fire, as we have, and
lived?  5:27 Go thou near, and hear all that the lord our god shall
say: and speak thou unto us all that the lord our god shall speak unto
thee; and we will hear it, and do it.

5:28 and the lord heard the voic of your words, when ye spake unto
me; and the lord said unto me, I have heard the voic of the word of
thi people, which they have spoken unto thee: they have well said all
that they have spoken.

5:29 O that there were such an heart in them, that they would fear me,
and keep all my command always, that it might be well with them,
and with their children for ever!  5:30 Go say to them, get you into
your tent again.

5:31 but as for thee, stand thou here by me, and I will speak unto
the all the commandments, and the statutes, and the judgments, which
thou shalt teach them, that they may do them in the land which I give
them to possess it.

5:32 Ye shall observ to do therefor as the lord your god hath
command you: ye shall not turn asid to the right hand or to the
left.

5:33 Ye shall walk in all the way which the lord your god hath
command you, that ye may live, and that it may be well with you, and
that ye may prolong your day in the land which ye shall possess.

6:1 now these are the commandments, the statutes, and the judgments,
which the lord your god command to teach you, that ye might do them
in the land whither ye go to possess it: 6:2 that thou mightest fear
th lord thi god, to keep all hi statut and hi commandments, which
i command thee, thou, and thi son, and thi son' son, all the day of
thi life; and that thi day may be prolonged.

6:3 hear therefore, O israel, and observ to do it; that it may be
wel with thee, and that ye may increas mightily, as the lord god of
thi father hath promis thee, in the land that floweth with milk and
honey.

6:4 hear, O israel: the lord our god is one lord: 6:5 and thou shalt
lov the lord thi god with all thine heart, and with all thi soul, and
with all thi might.

6:6 and these words, which I command thee thi day, shall be in thine
heart: 6:7 and thou shalt teach them dilig unto thi children, and
shalt talk of them when thou sittest in thine house, and when thou
walkest by the way, and when thou liest down, and when thou risest up.

6:8 and thou shalt bind them for a sign upon thine hand, and they
shal be as frontlet between thine eyes.

6:9 and thou shalt write them upon the post of thi house, and on thy
gates.

6:10 and it shall be, when the lord thi god shall have brought thee
into the land which he sware unto thi fathers, to abraham, to isaac,
and to jacob, to give thee great and goodli cities, which thou
buildedst not, 6:11 and hous full of all good things, which thou
filledst not, and well digged, which thou diggedst not, vineyard and
ol trees, which thou plantedst not; when thou shalt have eaten and
b full; 6:12 then bewar lest thou forget the lord, which brought
the forth out of the land of egypt, from the hous of bondage.

6:13 thou shalt fear the lord thi god, and serv him, and shalt swear
bi hi name.

6:14 Ye shall not go after other gods, of the god of the peopl which
ar round about you; 6:15 (for the lord thi god is a jealou god among
you) lest the anger of the lord thi god be kindl against thee, and
destroy thee from off the face of the earth.

6:16 Ye shall not tempt the lord your god, as ye tempt him in
massah.

6:17 Ye shall dilig keep the command of the lord your god,
and hi testimonies, and hi statutes, which he hath command thee.

6:18 and thou shalt do that which is right and good in the sight of
th lord: that it may be well with thee, and that thou mayest go in
and possess the good land which the lord sware unto thi fathers.

6:19 To cast out all thine enemi from befor thee, as the lord hath
spoken.

6:20 and when thi son asketh thee in time to come, saying, what mean
th testimonies, and the statutes, and the judgments, which the lord
our god hath command you?  6:21 then thou shalt say unto thi son, we
wer pharaoh' bondmen in egypt; and the lord brought us out of egypt
with a mighti hand: 6:22 and the lord shew sign and wonders, great
and sore, upon egypt, upon pharaoh, and upon all hi household, before
our eyes: 6:23 and he brought us out from thence, that he might bring
u in, to give us the land which he sware unto our fathers.

6:24 and the lord command us to do all these statutes, to fear the
lord our god, for our good always, that he might preserv us alive, as
it is at thi day.

6:25 and it shall be our righteousness, if we observ to do all these
command befor the lord our god, as he hath command us.

7:1 when the lord thi god shall bring thee into the land whither thou
goest to possess it, and hath cast out mani nation befor thee, the
hittites, and the girgashites, and the amorites, and the canaanites,
and the perizzites, and the hivites, and the jebusites, seven nations
great and mightier than thou; 7:2 and when the lord thi god shall
deliv them befor thee; thou shalt smite them, and utterli destroy
them; thou shalt make no coven with them, nor shew merci unto them:
7:3 neither shalt thou make marriag with them; thi daughter thou
shalt not give unto hi son, nor hi daughter shalt thou take unto thy
son.

7:4 for they will turn away thi son from follow me, that they may
serv other gods: so will the anger of the lord be kindl against
you, and destroy thee suddenly.

7:5 but thu shall ye deal with them; ye shall destroy their altars,
and break down their images, and cut down their groves, and burn their
graven imag with fire.

7:6 for thou art an holi peopl unto the lord thi god: the lord thy
god hath chosen thee to be a special peopl unto himself, abov all
peopl that are upon the face of the earth.

7:7 the lord did not set hi love upon you, nor choos you, becaus ye
wer more in number than ani people; for ye were the fewest of all
people: 7:8 but becaus the lord love you, and becaus he would keep
th oath which he had sworn unto your fathers, hath the lord brought
you out with a mighti hand, and redeem you out of the hous of
bondmen, from the hand of pharaoh king of egypt.

7:9 know therefor that the lord thi god, he is god, the faith god,
which keepeth coven and merci with them that love him and keep his
command to a thousand generations; 7:10 and repayeth them that
hat him to their face, to destroy them: he will not be slack to him
that hateth him, he will repay him to hi face.

7:11 thou shalt therefor keep the commandments, and the statutes, and
th judgments, which I command thee thi day, to do them.

7:12 wherefor it shall come to pass, if ye hearken to these
judgments, and keep, and do them, that the lord thi god shall keep
unto thee the coven and the merci which he sware unto thi fathers:
7:13 and he will love thee, and bless thee, and multipli thee: he will
also bless the fruit of thi womb, and the fruit of thi land, thi corn,
and thi wine, and thine oil, the increas of thi kine, and the flocks
of thi sheep, in the land which he sware unto thi father to give
thee.

7:14 thou shalt be bless abov all people: there shall not be male
or femal barren among you, or among your cattle.

7:15 and the lord will take away from thee all sickness, and will put
non of the evil diseas of egypt, which thou knowest, upon thee; but
wil lay them upon all them that hate thee.

7:16 and thou shalt consum all the peopl which the lord thi god
shal deliv thee; thine eye shall have no piti upon them: neither
shalt thou serv their gods; for that will be a snare unto thee.

7:17 If thou shalt say in thine heart, these nation are more than i;
how can I dispossess them?  7:18 thou shalt not be afraid of them: but
shalt well rememb what the lord thi god did unto pharaoh, and unto
al egypt; 7:19 the great temptat which thine eye saw, and the
signs, and the wonders, and the mighti hand, and the stretch out
arm, wherebi the lord thi god brought thee out: so shall the lord thy
god do unto all the peopl of whom thou art afraid.

7:20 moreov the lord thi god will send the hornet among them, until
they that are left, and hide themselv from thee, be destroyed.

7:21 thou shalt not be affright at them: for the lord thi god is
among you, a mighti god and terrible.

7:22 and the lord thi god will put out those nation befor thee by
littl and little: thou mayest not consum them at once, lest the
beast of the field increas upon thee.

7:23 but the lord thi god shall deliv them unto thee, and shall
destroy them with a mighti destruction, until they be destroyed.

7:24 and he shall deliv their king into thine hand, and thou shalt
destroy their name from under heaven: there shall no man be abl to
stand befor thee, until thou have destroy them.

7:25 the graven imag of their god shall ye burn with fire: thou
shalt not desir the silver or gold that is on them, nor take it unto
thee, lest thou be snare therin: for it is an abomin to the lord
thi god.

7:26 neither shalt thou bring an abomin into thine house, lest
thou be a curs thing like it: but thou shalt utterli detest it, and
thou shalt utterli abhor it; for it is a curs thing.

8:1 all the command which I command thee thi day shall ye
observ to do, that ye may live, and multiply, and go in and possess
th land which the lord sware unto your fathers.

8:2 and thou shalt rememb all the way which the lord thi god led
the these forti year in the wilderness, to humbl thee, and to prove
thee, to know what wa in thine heart, whether thou wouldest keep his
commandments, or no.

8:3 and he humbl thee, and suffer thee to hunger, and fed thee
with manna, which thou knewest not, neither did thi father know; that
h might make thee know that man doth not live by bread only, but by
everi word that proceedeth out of the mouth of the lord doth man live.

8:4 thi raiment wax not old upon thee, neither did thi foot swell,
thes forti years.

8:5 thou shalt also consid in thine heart, that, as a man chasteneth
hi son, so the lord thi god chasteneth thee.

8:6 therefor thou shalt keep the command of the lord thi god, to
walk in hi ways, and to fear him.

8:7 for the lord thi god bringeth thee into a good land, a land of
brook of water, of fountain and depth that spring out of valleys
and hills; 8:8 A land of wheat, and barley, and vines, and fig trees,
and pomegranates; a land of oil olive, and honey; 8:9 A land wherein
th shalt eat bread without scarceness, thou shalt not lack ani thing
in it; a land whose stone are iron, and out of whose hill thou
mayest dig brass.

8:10 when thou hast eaten and art full, then thou shalt bless the lord
thi god for the good land which he hath given thee.

8:11 bewar that thou forget not the lord thi god, in not keep his
commandments, and hi judgments, and hi statutes, which I command
the thi day: 8:12 lest when thou hast eaten and art full, and hast
built goodli houses, and dwelt therein; 8:13 and when thi herd and
thi flock multiply, and thi silver and thi gold is multiplied, and
al that thou hast is multiplied; 8:14 then thine heart be lift up,
and thou forget the lord thi god, which brought thee forth out of the
land of egypt, from the hous of bondage; 8:15 who led thee through
that great and terribl wilderness, wherein were fieri serpents, and
scorpions, and drought, where there wa no water; who brought thee
forth water out of the rock of flint; 8:16 who fed thee in the
wild with manna, which thi father knew not, that he might
humbl thee, and that he might prove thee, to do thee good at thy
latt end; 8:17 and thou say in thine heart, My power and the might
of mine hand hath gotten me thi wealth.

8:18 but thou shalt rememb the lord thi god: for it is he that
giveth thee power to get wealth, that he may establish hi covenant
which he sware unto thi fathers, as it is thi day.

8:19 and it shall be, if thou do at all forget the lord thi god, and
walk after other gods, and serv them, and worship them, I testify
against you thi day that ye shall sure perish.

8:20 As the nation which the lord destroyeth befor your face, so
shal ye perish; becaus ye would not be obedi unto the voic of
th lord your god.

9:1 hear, O israel: thou art to pass over jordan thi day, to go in to
possess nation greater and mightier than thyself, citi great and
fenc up to heaven, 9:2 A peopl great and tall, the children of the
anakims, whom thou knowest, and of whom thou hast heard say, who can
stand befor the children of anak!  9:3 understand therefor thi day,
that the lord thi god is he which goeth over befor thee; as a
consum fire he shall destroy them, and he shall bring them down
befor thi face: so shalt thou drive them out, and destroy them
quickly, as the lord hath said unto thee.

9:4 speak not thou in thine heart, after that the lord thi god hath
cast them out from befor thee, saying, for my righteous the lord
hath brought me in to possess thi land: but for the wicked of
thes nation the lord doth drive them out from befor thee.

9:5 not for thi righteousness, or for the upright of thine heart,
dost thou go to possess their land: but for the wicked of these
n the lord thi god doth drive them out from befor thee, and
that he may perform the word which the lord sware unto thi fathers,
abraham, isaac, and jacob.

9:6 understand therefore, that the lord thi god giveth thee not this
good land to possess it for thi righteousness; for thou art a
stiffneck people.

9:7 remember, and forget not, how thou provokedst the lord thi god to
wrath in the wilderness: from the day that thou didst depart out of
th land of egypt, until ye came unto thi place, ye have been
rebelli against the lord.

9:8 also in horeb ye provok the lord to wrath, so that the lord was
angri with you to have destroy you.

9:9 when I wa gone up into the mount to receiv the tabl of stone,
even the tabl of the coven which the lord made with you, then i
abod in the mount forti day and forti nights, I neither did eat
bread nor drink water: 9:10 and the lord deliv unto me two tables
of stone written with the finger of god; and on them wa written
accord to all the words, which the lord spake with you in the mount
out of the midst of the fire in the day of the assembly.

9:11 and it came to pass at the end of forti day and forti nights,
that the lord gave me the two tabl of stone, even the tabl of the
covenant.

9:12 and the lord said unto me, arise, get thee down quickli from
hence; for thi peopl which thou hast brought forth out of egypt have
corrupt themselves; they are quickli turn asid out of the way
which I command them; they have made them a molten image.

9:13 furthermor the lord spake unto me, saying, I have seen this
people, and, behold, it is a stiffneck people: 9:14 let me alone,
that I may destroy them, and blot out their name from under heaven:
and I will make of thee a nation mightier and greater than they.

9:15 So I turn and came down from the mount, and the mount burned
