with fire: and the two tabl of the coven were in my two hands.

9:16 and I looked, and, behold, ye had sin against the lord your
god, and had made you a molten calf: ye had turn asid quickli out
of the way which the lord had command you.

9:17 and I took the two tables, and cast them out of my two hands, and
brak them befor your eyes.

9:18 and I fell down befor the lord, as at the first, forti day and
forti nights: I did neither eat bread, nor drink water, becaus of all
your sin which ye sinned, in do wickedli in the sight of the lord,
to provok him to anger.

9:19 for I wa afraid of the anger and hot displeasure, wherewith the
lord wa wroth against you to destroy you. but the lord hearken unto
m at that time also.

9:20 and the lord wa veri angri with aaron to have destroy him: and
i pray for aaron also the same time.

9:21 and I took your sin, the calf which ye had made, and burnt it
with fire, and stamp it, and ground it veri small, even until it was
a small as dust: and I cast the dust thereof into the brook that
descend out of the mount.

9:22 and at taberah, and at massah, and at kibrothhattaavah, ye
provok the lord to wrath.

9:23 likewis when the lord sent you from kadeshbarnea, saying, Go up
and possess the land which I have given you; then ye rebel against
th command of the lord your god, and ye believ him not, nor
hearken to hi voice.

9:24 Ye have been rebelli against the lord from the day that I knew
you.

9:25 thu I fell down befor the lord forti day and forti nights, as
i fell down at the first; becaus the lord had said he would destroy
you.

9:26 I pray therefor unto the lord, and said, O lord god, destroy
not thi peopl and thine inheritance, which thou hast redeem through
thi greatness, which thou hast brought forth out of egypt with a
mighti hand.

9:27 rememb thi servants, abraham, isaac, and jacob; look not unto
th stubborn of thi people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their
sin: 9:28 lest the land whenc thou broughtest us out say, becaus the
lord wa not abl to bring them into the land which he promis them,
and becaus he hate them, he hath brought them out to slay them in
th wilderness.

9:29 yet they are thi peopl and thine inheritance, which thou
broughtest out by thi mighti power and by thi stretch out arm.

10:1 At that time the lord said unto me, hew thee two tabl of stone
lik unto the first, and come up unto me into the mount, and make thee
an ark of wood.

10:2 and I will write on the tabl the word that were in the first
tabl which thou brakest, and thou shalt put them in the ark.

10:3 and I made an ark of shittim wood, and hew two tabl of stone
lik unto the first, and went up into the mount, have the two tables
in mine hand.

10:4 and he wrote on the tables, accord to the first writing, the
ten commandments, which the lord spake unto you in the mount out of
th midst of the fire in the day of the assembly: and the lord gave
them unto me.

10:5 and I turn myself and came down from the mount, and put the
tabl in the ark which I had made; and there they be, as the lord
command me.

10:6 and the children of israel took their journey from beeroth of the
children of jaakan to mosera: there aaron died, and there he was
buried; and eleazar hi son minist in the priest' offic in his
stead.

10:7 from thenc they journey unto gudgodah; and from gudgodah to
jotbath, a land of river of waters.

10:8 At that time the lord separ the tribe of levi, to bear the
ark of the coven of the lord, to stand befor the lord to minister
unto him, and to bless in hi name, unto thi day.

10:9 wherefor levi hath no part nor inherit with hi brethren;
th lord is hi inheritance, accord as the lord thi god promised
him.

10:10 and I stay in the mount, accord to the first time, forty
day and forti nights; and the lord hearken unto me at that time
also, and the lord would not destroy thee.

10:11 and the lord said unto me, arise, take thi journey befor the
people, that they may go in and possess the land, which I sware unto
their father to give unto them.

10:12 and now, israel, what doth the lord thi god requir of thee, but
to fear the lord thi god, to walk in all hi ways, and to love him,
and to serv the lord thi god with all thi heart and with all thy
soul, 10:13 To keep the command of the lord, and hi statutes,
which I command thee thi day for thi good?  10:14 behold, the heaven
and the heaven of heaven is the lord' thi god, the earth also, with
al that therein is.

10:15 onli the lord had a delight in thi father to love them, and he
chos their seed after them, even you abov all people, as it is this
day.

10:16 circumcis therefor the foreskin of your heart, and be no more
stiffnecked.

10:17 for the lord your god is god of gods, and lord of lords, a great
god, a mighty, and a terrible, which regardeth not persons, nor taketh
reward: 10:18 He doth execut the judgment of the fatherless and
widow, and loveth the stranger, in give him food and raiment.

10:19 love ye therefor the stranger: for ye were stranger in the
land of egypt.

10:20 thou shalt fear the lord thi god; him shalt thou serve, and to
him shalt thou cleave, and swear by hi name.

10:21 He is thi praise, and he is thi god, that hath done for thee
thes great and terribl things, which thine eye have seen.

10:22 thi father went down into egypt with threescor and ten
persons; and now the lord thi god hath made thee as the star of
heaven for multitude.

11:1 therefor thou shalt love the lord thi god, and keep hi charge,
and hi statutes, and hi judgments, and hi commandments, alway.

11:2 and know ye thi day: for I speak not with your children which
hav not known, and which have not seen the chastis of the lord
your god, hi greatness, hi mighti hand, and hi stretch out arm,
11:3 and hi miracles, and hi acts, which he did in the midst of
egypt unto pharaoh the king of egypt, and unto all hi land; 11:4 and
what he did unto the armi of egypt, unto their horses, and to their
chariots; how he made the water of the red sea to overflow them as
they pursu after you, and how the lord hath destroy them unto this
day; 11:5 and what he did unto you in the wilderness, until ye came
into thi place; 11:6 and what he did unto dathan and abiram, the sons
of eliab, the son of reuben: how the earth open her mouth, and
swallow them up, and their households, and their tents, and all the
subst that wa in their possession, in the midst of all israel:
11:7 but your eye have seen all the great act of the lord which he
did.

11:8 therefor shall ye keep all the command which I command you
thi day, that ye may be strong, and go in and possess the land,
whith ye go to possess it; 11:9 and that ye may prolong your day in
th land, which the lord sware unto your father to give unto them and
to their seed, a land that floweth with milk and honey.

11:10 for the land, whither thou goest in to possess it, is not as the
land of egypt, from whenc ye came out, where thou sowedst thi seed,
and wateredst it with thi foot, as a garden of herbs: 11:11 but the
land, whither ye go to possess it, is a land of hill and valleys, and
drinketh water of the rain of heaven: 11:12 A land which the lord thy
god careth for: the eye of the lord thi god are alway upon it, from
th begin of the year even unto the end of the year.

11:13 and it shall come to pass, if ye shall hearken dilig unto
mi command which I command you thi day, to love the lord your
god, and to serv him with all your heart and with all your soul,
11:14 that I will give you the rain of your land in hi due season,
th first rain and the latter rain, that thou mayest gather in thy
corn, and thi wine, and thine oil.

11:15 and I will send grass in thi field for thi cattle, that thou
mayest eat and be full.

11:16 take heed to yourselves, that your heart be not deceived, and ye
turn aside, and serv other gods, and worship them; 11:17 and then the
lord' wrath be kindl against you, and he shut up the heaven, that
ther be no rain, and that the land yield not her fruit; and lest ye
perish quickli from off the good land which the lord giveth you.

11:18 therefor shall ye lay up these my word in your heart and in
your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand, that they may be
a frontlet between your eyes.

11:19 and ye shall teach them your children, speak of them when
thou sittest in thine house, and when thou walkest by the way, when
thou liest down, and when thou risest up.

11:20 and thou shalt write them upon the door post of thine house,
and upon thi gates: 11:21 that your day may be multiplied, and the
day of your children, in the land which the lord sware unto your
fath to give them, as the day of heaven upon the earth.

11:22 for if ye shall dilig keep all these command which i
command you, to do them, to love the lord your god, to walk in all his
ways, and to cleav unto him; 11:23 then will the lord drive out all
thes nation from befor you, and ye shall possess greater nations
and mightier than yourselves.

11:24 everi place whereon the sole of your feet shall tread shall be
yours: from the wilder and lebanon, from the river, the river
euphrates, even unto the uttermost sea shall your coast be.

11:25 there shall no man be abl to stand befor you: for the lord
your god shall lay the fear of you and the dread of you upon all the
land that ye shall tread upon, as he hath said unto you.

11:26 behold, I set befor you thi day a bless and a curse; 11:27
a blessing, if ye obey the command of the lord your god, which i
command you thi day: 11:28 and a curse, if ye will not obey the
command of the lord your god, but turn asid out of the way which
i command you thi day, to go after other gods, which ye have not
known.

11:29 and it shall come to pass, when the lord thi god hath brought
the in unto the land whither thou goest to possess it, that thou
shalt put the bless upon mount gerizim, and the curs upon mount
ebal.

11:30 are they not on the other side jordan, by the way where the sun
goeth down, in the land of the canaanites, which dwell in the
champaign over against gilgal, besid the plain of moreh?  11:31 for
y shall pass over jordan to go in to possess the land which the lord
your god giveth you, and ye shall possess it, and dwell therein.

11:32 and ye shall observ to do all the statut and judgment which
i set befor you thi day.

12:1 these are the statut and judgments, which ye shall observ to
do in the land, which the lord god of thi father giveth thee to
possess it, all the day that ye live upon the earth.

12:2 Ye shall utterli destroy all the places, wherein the nations
which ye shall possess serv their gods, upon the high mountains, and
upon the hills, and under everi green tree: 12:3 and ye shall
overthrow their altars, and break their pillars, and burn their groves
with fire; and ye shall hew down the graven imag of their gods, and
destroy the name of them out of that place.

12:4 Ye shall not do so unto the lord your god.

12:5 but unto the place which the lord your god shall choos out of
al your tribe to put hi name there, even unto hi habit shall
y seek, and thither thou shalt come: 12:6 and thither ye shall bring
your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, and your tithes, and heave
off of your hand, and your vows, and your freewil offerings,
and the firstl of your herd and of your flocks: 12:7 and there ye
shal eat befor the lord your god, and ye shall rejoic in all that
y put your hand unto, ye and your households, wherein the lord thy
god hath bless thee.

12:8 Ye shall not do after all the thing that we do here thi day,
everi man whatsoev is right in hi own eyes.

12:9 for ye are not as yet come to the rest and to the inheritance,
which the lord your god giveth you.

12:10 but when ye go over jordan, and dwell in the land which the lord
your god giveth you to inherit, and when he giveth you rest from all
your enemi round about, so that ye dwell in safety; 12:11 then there
shal be a place which the lord your god shall choos to caus his
nam to dwell there; thither shall ye bring all that I command you;
your burnt offerings, and your sacrifices, your tithes, and the heave
off of your hand, and all your choic vow which ye vow unto the
lord: 12:12 and ye shall rejoic befor the lord your god, ye, and
your sons, and your daughters, and your menservants, and your
maidservants, and the levit that is within your gates; forasmuch as
h hath no part nor inherit with you.

12:13 take heed to thyself that thou offer not thi burnt offer in
everi place that thou seest: 12:14 but in the place which the lord
shal choos in one of thi tribes, there thou shalt offer thi burnt
offerings, and there thou shalt do all that I command thee.

12:15 notwithstand thou mayest kill and eat flesh in all thi gates,
whatsoev thi soul lusteth after, accord to the bless of the
lord thi god which he hath given thee: the unclean and the clean may
eat thereof, as of the roebuck, and as of the hart.

12:16 onli ye shall not eat the blood; ye shall pour it upon the earth
a water.

12:17 thou mayest not eat within thi gate the tith of thi corn, or
of thi wine, or of thi oil, or the firstl of thi herd or of thy
flock, nor ani of thi vow which thou vowest, nor thi freewill
offerings, or heav offer of thine hand: 12:18 but thou must eat
them befor the lord thi god in the place which the lord thi god shall
choose, thou, and thi son, and thi daughter, and thi manservant, and
thi maidservant, and the levit that is within thi gates: and thou
shalt rejoic befor the lord thi god in all that thou puttest thine
hand unto.

12:19 take heed to thyself that thou forsak not the levit as long as
thou livest upon the earth.

12:20 when the lord thi god shall enlarg thi border, as he hath
promis thee, and thou shalt say, I will eat flesh, becaus thi soul
longeth to eat flesh; thou mayest eat flesh, whatsoev thi soul
lusteth after.

12:21 If the place which the lord thi god hath chosen to put hi name
ther be too far from thee, then thou shalt kill of thi herd and of
thi flock, which the lord hath given thee, as I have command thee,
and thou shalt eat in thi gate whatsoev thi soul lusteth after.

12:22 even as the roebuck and the hart is eaten, so thou shalt eat
them: the unclean and the clean shall eat of them alike.

12:23 onli be sure that thou eat not the blood: for the blood is the
life; and thou mayest not eat the life with the flesh.

12:24 thou shalt not eat it; thou shalt pour it upon the earth as
water.

12:25 thou shalt not eat it; that it may go well with thee, and with
thi children after thee, when thou shalt do that which is right in the
sight of the lord.

12:26 onli thi holi thing which thou hast, and thi vows, thou shalt
take, and go unto the place which the lord shall choose: 12:27 and
thou shalt offer thi burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon
th altar of the lord thi god: and the blood of thi sacrific shall
b pour out upon the altar of the lord thi god, and thou shalt eat
th flesh.

12:28 observ and hear all these word which I command thee, that it
may go well with thee, and with thi children after thee for ever, when
thou doest that which is good and right in the sight of the lord thy
god.

12:29 when the lord thi god shall cut off the nation from before
thee, whither thou goest to possess them, and thou succeedest them,
and dwellest in their land; 12:30 take heed to thyself that thou be
not snare by follow them, after that they be destroy from before
thee; and that thou enquir not after their gods, saying, how did
thes nation serv their gods? even so will I do likewise.

12:31 thou shalt not do so unto the lord thi god: for every
abomin to the lord, which he hateth, have they done unto their
gods; for even their son and their daughter they have burnt in the
fir to their gods.

12:32 what thing soever I command you, observ to do it: thou shalt
not add thereto, nor diminish from it.

13:1 If there aris among you a prophet, or a dreamer of dreams, and
giveth thee a sign or a wonder, 13:2 and the sign or the wonder come
to pass, whereof he spake unto thee, saying, let us go after other
gods, which thou hast not known, and let us serv them; 13:3 thou
shalt not hearken unto the word of that prophet, or that dreamer of
dreams: for the lord your god proveth you, to know whether ye love the
lord your god with all your heart and with all your soul.

13:4 Ye shall walk after the lord your god, and fear him, and keep his
commandments, and obey hi voice, and ye shall serv him, and cleave
unto him.

13:5 and that prophet, or that dreamer of dreams, shall be put to
death; becaus he hath spoken to turn you away from the lord your god,
which brought you out of the land of egypt, and redeem you out of
th hous of bondage, to thrust thee out of the way which the lord thy
god command thee to walk in. So shalt thou put the evil away from
th midst of thee.

13:6 If thi brother, the son of thi mother, or thi son, or thy
daughter, or the wife of thi bosom, or thi friend, which is as thine
own soul, entic thee secretly, saying, let us go and serv other
gods, which thou hast not known, thou, nor thi fathers; 13:7 namely,
of the god of the peopl which are round about you, nigh unto thee,
or far off from thee, from the one end of the earth even unto the
oth end of the earth; 13:8 thou shalt not consent unto him, nor
hearken unto him; neither shall thine eye piti him, neither shalt thou
spare, neither shalt thou conceal him: 13:9 but thou shalt sure kill
him; thine hand shall be first upon him to put him to death, and
afterward the hand of all the people.

13:10 and thou shalt stone him with stones, that he die; becaus he
hath sought to thrust thee away from the lord thi god, which brought
the out of the land of egypt, from the hous of bondage.

13:11 and all israel shall hear, and fear, and shall do no more any
such wicked as thi is among you.

13:12 If thou shalt hear say in one of thi cities, which the lord thy
god hath given thee to dwell there, saying, 13:13 certain men, the
children of belial, are gone out from among you, and have withdrawn
th inhabit of their city, saying, let us go and serv other gods,
which ye have not known; 13:14 then shalt thou enquire, and make
search, and ask diligently; and, behold, if it be truth, and the thing
certain, that such abomin is wrought among you; 13:15 thou shalt
sur smite the inhabit of that citi with the edg of the sword,
destroy it utterly, and all that is therein, and the cattle
thereof, with the edg of the sword.

13:16 and thou shalt gather all the spoil of it into the midst of the
street thereof, and shalt burn with fire the city, and all the spoil
thereof everi whit, for the lord thi god: and it shall be an heap for
ever; it shall not be built again.

13:17 and there shall cleav nought of the curs thing to thine hand:
that the lord may turn from the fierc of hi anger, and shew thee
mercy, and have compass upon thee, and multipli thee, as he hath
sworn unto thi fathers; 13:18 when thou shalt hearken to the voic of
th lord thi god, to keep all hi command which I command thee
thi day, to do that which is right in the eye of the lord thi god.

14:1 Ye are the children of the lord your god: ye shall not cut
yourselves, nor make ani bald between your eye for the dead.

14:2 for thou art an holi peopl unto the lord thi god, and the lord
hath chosen thee to be a peculiar peopl unto himself, abov all the
nat that are upon the earth.

14:3 thou shalt not eat ani abomin thing.

14:4 these are the beast which ye shall eat: the ox, the sheep, and
th goat, 14:5 the hart, and the roebuck, and the fallow deer, and the
wild goat, and the pygarg, and the wild ox, and the chamois.

14:6 and everi beast that parteth the hoof, and cleaveth the cleft
into two claws, and cheweth the cud among the beasts, that ye shall
eat.

14:7 nevertheless these ye shall not eat of them that chew the cud, or
of them that divid the cloven hoof; as the camel, and the hare, and
th coney: for they chew the cud, but divid not the hoof; therefore
they are unclean unto you.

14:8 and the swine, becaus it divideth the hoof, yet cheweth not the
cud, it is unclean unto you: ye shall not eat of their flesh, nor
touch their dead carcase.

14:9 these ye shall eat of all that are in the waters: all that have
fin and scale shall ye eat: 14:10 and whatsoev hath not fin and
scal ye may not eat; it is unclean unto you.

14:11 Of all clean bird ye shall eat.

14:12 but these are they of which ye shall not eat: the eagle, and the
ossifrage, and the ospray, 14:13 and the glede, and the kite, and the
vultur after hi kind, 14:14 and everi raven after hi kind, 14:15
and the owl, and the night hawk, and the cuckow, and the hawk after
hi kind, 14:16 the littl owl, and the great owl, and the swan, 14:17
and the pelican, and the gier eagle, and the cormorant, 14:18 and the
stork, and the heron after her kind, and the lapwing, and the bat.

14:19 and everi creep thing that flieth is unclean unto you: they
shal not be eaten.

14:20 but of all clean fowl ye may eat.

14:21 Ye shall not eat of anyth that dieth of itself: thou shalt
giv it unto the stranger that is in thi gates, that he may eat it; or
thou mayest sell it unto an alien: for thou art an holi peopl unto
th lord thi god.

thou shalt not seeth a kid in hi mother' milk.

14:22 thou shalt truli tith all the increas of thi seed, that the
field bringeth forth year by year.

14:23 and thou shalt eat befor the lord thi god, in the place which
h shall choos to place hi name there, the tith of thi corn, of thy
wine, and of thine oil, and the firstl of thi herd and of thy
flocks; that thou mayest learn to fear the lord thi god always.

14:24 and if the way be too long for thee, so that thou art not able
to carri it; or if the place be too far from thee, which the lord thy
god shall choos to set hi name there, when the lord thi god hath
bless thee: 14:25 then shalt thou turn it into money, and bind up
th money in thine hand, and shalt go unto the place which the lord
thi god shall choose: 14:26 and thou shalt bestow that money for
whatsoev thi soul lusteth after, for oxen, or for sheep, or for
wine, or for strong drink, or for whatsoev thi soul desireth: and
thou shalt eat there befor the lord thi god, and thou shalt rejoice,
thou, and thine household, 14:27 and the levit that is within thy
gates; thou shalt not forsak him; for he hath no part nor inheritance
with thee.

14:28 At the end of three year thou shalt bring forth all the tithe
of thine increas the same year, and shalt lay it up within thi gates:
14:29 and the levite, (becaus he hath no part nor inherit with
thee,) and the stranger, and the fatherless, and the widow, which are
within thi gates, shall come, and shall eat and be satisfied; that the
lord thi god may bless thee in all the work of thine hand which thou
doest.

15:1 At the end of everi seven year thou shalt make a release.

15:2 and thi is the manner of the release: everi creditor that
lendeth ought unto hi neighbour shall releas it; he shall not exact
it of hi neighbour, or of hi brother; becaus it is call the
lord' release.

15:3 Of a foreign thou mayest exact it again: but that which is
thin with thi brother thine hand shall release; 15:4 save when there
shal be no poor among you; for the lord shall greatli bless thee in
th land which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inherit to
possess it: 15:5 onli if thou care hearken unto the voic of the
lord thi god, to observ to do all these command which I command
the thi day.

15:6 for the lord thi god blesseth thee, as he promis thee: and thou
shalt lend unto mani nations, but thou shalt not borrow; and thou
shalt reign over mani nations, but they shall not reign over thee.

15:7 If there be among you a poor man of one of thi brethren within
ani of thi gate in thi land which the lord thi god giveth thee, thou
shalt not harden thine heart, nor shut thine hand from thi poor
brother: 15:8 but thou shalt open thine hand wide unto him, and shalt
sur lend him suffici for hi need, in that which he wanteth.

15:9 bewar that there be not a thought in thi wick heart, saying,
th seventh year, the year of release, is at hand; and thine eye be
evil against thi poor brother, and thou givest him nought; and he cry
unto the lord against thee, and it be sin unto thee.

15:10 thou shalt sure give him, and thine heart shall not be grieved
when thou givest unto him: becaus that for thi thing the lord thy
god shall bless thee in all thi works, and in all that thou puttest
thin hand unto.

15:11 for the poor shall never ceas out of the land: therefor i
command thee, saying, thou shalt open thine hand wide unto thy
brother, to thi poor, and to thi needy, in thi land.

15:12 and if thi brother, an hebrew man, or an hebrew woman, be sold
unto thee, and serv thee six years; then in the seventh year thou
shalt let him go free from thee.

15:13 and when thou sendest him out free from thee, thou shalt not let
him go away empty: 15:14 thou shalt furnish him liber out of thy
flock, and out of thi floor, and out of thi winepress: of that
wherewith the lord thi god hath bless thee thou shalt give unto him.

15:15 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in the land of
egypt, and the lord thi god redeem thee: therefor I command thee
thi thing to day.

15:16 and it shall be, if he say unto thee, I will not go away from
thee; becaus he loveth thee and thine house, becaus he is well with
thee; 15:17 then thou shalt take an aul, and thrust it through hi ear
unto the door, and he shall be thi servant for ever. and also unto thy
maidserv thou shalt do likewise.

15:18 It shall not seem hard unto thee, when thou sendest him away
fre from thee; for he hath been worth a doubl hire servant to thee,
in serv thee six years: and the lord thi god shall bless thee in
al that thou doest.

15:19 all the firstl male that come of thi herd and of thi flock
thou shalt sanctifi unto the lord thi god: thou shalt do no work with
th firstl of thi bullock, nor shear the firstl of thi sheep.

15:20 thou shalt eat it befor the lord thi god year by year in the
plac which the lord shall choose, thou and thi household.

15:21 and if there be ani blemish therein, as if it be lame, or blind,
or have ani ill blemish, thou shalt not sacrific it unto the lord thy
god.

15:22 thou shalt eat it within thi gates: the unclean and the clean
person shall eat it alike, as the roebuck, and as the hart.

15:23 onli thou shalt not eat the blood thereof; thou shalt pour it
upon the ground as water.

16:1 observ the month of abib, and keep the passov unto the lord
thi god: for in the month of abib the lord thi god brought thee forth
out of egypt by night.

16:2 thou shalt therefor sacrific the passov unto the lord thy
god, of the flock and the herd, in the place which the lord shall
choos to place hi name there.

16:3 thou shalt eat no leaven bread with it; seven day shalt thou
eat unleaven bread therewith, even the bread of affliction; for thou
camest forth out of the land of egypt in haste: that thou mayest
rememb the day when thou camest forth out of the land of egypt all
th day of thi life.

16:4 and there shall be no leaven bread seen with thee in all thy
coast seven days; neither shall there ani thing of the flesh, which
thou sacrificedst the first day at even, remain all night until the
morning.

16:5 thou mayest not sacrific the passov within ani of thi gates,
which the lord thi god giveth thee: 16:6 but at the place which the
lord thi god shall choos to place hi name in, there thou shalt
sacrific the passov at even, at the go down of the sun, at the
season that thou camest forth out of egypt.

16:7 and thou shalt roast and eat it in the place which the lord thy
god shall choose: and thou shalt turn in the morning, and go unto thy
tents.

16:8 six day thou shalt eat unleaven bread: and on the seventh day
shal be a solemn assembl to the lord thi god: thou shalt do no work
therein.

16:9 seven week shalt thou number unto thee: begin to number the
seven week from such time as thou beginnest to put the sickl to the
corn.

16:10 and thou shalt keep the feast of week unto the lord thi god
with a tribut of a freewil offer of thine hand, which thou shalt
giv unto the lord thi god, accord as the lord thi god hath blessed
thee: 16:11 and thou shalt rejoic befor the lord thi god, thou, and
thi son, and thi daughter, and thi manservant, and thi maidservant,
and the levit that is within thi gates, and the stranger, and the
fatherless, and the widow, that are among you, in the place which the
lord thi god hath chosen to place hi name there.

16:12 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in egypt: and
thou shalt observ and do these statutes.

16:13 thou shalt observ the feast of tabernacl seven days, after
that thou hast gather in thi corn and thi wine: 16:14 and thou shalt
rejoic in thi feast, thou, and thi son, and thi daughter, and thy
manservant, and thi maidservant, and the levite, the stranger, and the
fatherless, and the widow, that are within thi gates.

16:15 seven day shalt thou keep a solemn feast unto the lord thi god
in the place which the lord shall choose: becaus the lord thi god
shal bless thee in all thine increase, and in all the work of thine
hands, therefor thou shalt sure rejoice.

16:16 three time in a year shall all thi male appear befor the lord
thi god in the place which he shall choose; in the feast of unleavened
bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles: and
they shall not appear befor the lord empty: 16:17 everi man shall
giv as he is able, accord to the bless of the lord thi god
which he hath given thee.

16:18 judg and offic shalt thou make thee in all thi gates, which
th lord thi god giveth thee, throughout thi tribes: and they shall
judg the peopl with just judgment.

16:19 thou shalt not wrest judgment; thou shalt not respect persons,
neith take a gift: for a gift doth blind the eye of the wise, and
pervert the word of the righteous.

16:20 that which is altogeth just shalt thou follow, that thou
mayest live, and inherit the land which the lord thi god giveth thee.

16:21 thou shalt not plant thee a grove of ani tree near unto the
altar of the lord thi god, which thou shalt make thee.

16:22 neither shalt thou set thee up ani image; which the lord thi god
hateth.

17:1 thou shalt not sacrific unto the lord thi god ani bullock, or
sheep, wherein is blemish, or ani evilfavouredness: for that is an
abomin unto the lord thi god.

17:2 If there be found among you, within ani of thi gate which the
lord thi god giveth thee, man or woman, that hath wrought wickedness
in the sight of the lord thi god, in transgress hi covenant, 17:3
and hath gone and serv other gods, and worship them, either the
sun, or moon, or ani of the host of heaven, which I have not
commanded; 17:4 and it be told thee, and thou hast heard of it, and
enquir diligently, and, behold, it be true, and the thing certain,
that such abomin is wrought in israel: 17:5 then shalt thou bring
forth that man or that woman, which have commit that wick thing,
unto thi gates, even that man or that woman, and shalt stone them with
stones, till they die.

17:6 At the mouth of two witnesses, or three witnesses, shall he that
i worthi of death be put to death; but at the mouth of one wit he
shal not be put to death.

17:7 the hand of the wit shall be first upon him to put him to
death, and afterward the hand of all the people. So thou shalt put
th evil away from among you.

17:8 If there aris a matter too hard for thee in judgment, between
blood and blood, between plea and plea, and between stroke and stroke,
b matter of controversi within thi gates: then shalt thou arise,
and get thee up into the place which the lord thi god shall choose;
17:9 and thou shalt come unto the priest the levites, and unto the
judg that shall be in those days, and enquire; and they shall shew
the the sentenc of judgment: 17:10 and thou shalt do accord to
th sentence, which they of that place which the lord shall choose
shal shew thee; and thou shalt observ to do accord to all that
they inform thee: 17:11 accord to the sentenc of the law which
they shall teach thee, and accord to the judgment which they shall
tel thee, thou shalt do: thou shalt not declin from the sentence
which they shall shew thee, to the right hand, nor to the left.

17:12 and the man that will do presumptuously, and will not hearken
unto the priest that standeth to minist there befor the lord thy
god, or unto the judge, even that man shall die: and thou shalt put
away the evil from israel.

17:13 and all the peopl shall hear, and fear, and do no more
presumptuously.

17:14 when thou art come unto the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee, and shalt possess it, and shalt dwell therein, and shalt say, i
wil set a king over me, like as all the nation that are about me;
17:15 thou shalt in ani wise set him king over thee, whom the lord thy
god shall choose: one from among thi brethren shalt thou set king over
thee: thou mayest not set a stranger over thee, which is not thy
brother.

17:16 but he shall not multipli hors to himself, nor caus the
peopl to return to egypt, to the end that he should multipli horses:
forasmuch as the lord hath said unto you, Ye shall henceforth return
no more that way.

17:17 neither shall he multipli wive to himself, that hi heart turn
not away: neither shall he greatli multipli to himself silver and
gold.

17:18 and it shall be, when he sitteth upon the throne of hi kingdom,
that he shall write him a copi of thi law in a book out of that which
i befor the priest the levites: 17:19 and it shall be with him, and
h shall read therein all the day of hi life: that he may learn to
fear the lord hi god, to keep all the word of thi law and these
statutes, to do them: 17:20 that hi heart be not lift up abov his
brethren, and that he turn not asid from the commandment, to the
right hand, or to the left: to the end that he may prolong hi day in
hi kingdom, he, and hi children, in the midst of israel.

18:1 the priest the levites, and all the tribe of levi, shall have no
part nor inherit with israel: they shall eat the offer of the
lord made by fire, and hi inheritance.

18:2 therefor shall they have no inherit among their brethren:
th lord is their inheritance, as he hath said unto them.

18:3 and thi shall be the priest' due from the people, from them
that offer a sacrifice, whether it be ox or sheep; and they shall give
unto the priest the shoulder, and the two cheeks, and the maw.

18:4 the firstfruit also of thi corn, of thi wine, and of thine oil,
and the first of the fleec of thi sheep, shalt thou give him.

18:5 for the lord thi god hath chosen him out of all thi tribes, to
stand to minist in the name of the lord, him and hi son for ever.

18:6 and if a levit come from ani of thi gate out of all israel,
wher he sojourned, and come with all the desir of hi mind unto the
plac which the lord shall choose; 18:7 then he shall minist in the
nam of the lord hi god, as all hi brethren the levit do, which
stand there befor the lord.

18:8 they shall have like portion to eat, besid that which cometh of
th sale of hi patrimony.

18:9 when thou art come into the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee, thou shalt not learn to do after the abomin of those
nations.

18:10 there shall not be found among you ani one that maketh hi son
or hi daughter to pass through the fire, or that useth divination, or
an observ of times, or an enchanter, or a witch.

18:11 Or a charmer, or a consult with familiar spirits, or a wizard,
or a necromancer.

18:12 for all that do these thing are an abomin unto the lord:
and becaus of these abomin the lord thi god doth drive them out
from befor thee.

18:13 thou shalt be perfect with the lord thi god.

18:14 for these nations, which thou shalt possess, hearken unto
observ of times, and unto diviners: but as for thee, the lord thy
god hath not suffer thee so to do.

18:15 the lord thi god will rais up unto thee a prophet from the
midst of thee, of thi brethren, like unto me; unto him ye shall
hearken; 18:16 accord to all that thou desiredst of the lord thy
god in horeb in the day of the assembly, saying, let me not hear again
th voic of the lord my god, neither let me see thi great fire any
more, that I die not.

18:17 and the lord said unto me, they have well spoken that which they
hav spoken.

18:18 I will rais them up a prophet from among their brethren, like
unto thee, and will put my word in hi mouth; and he shall speak unto
them all that I shall command him.

18:19 and it shall come to pass, that whosoev will not hearken unto
mi word which he shall speak in my name, I will requir it of him.

18:20 but the prophet, which shall presum to speak a word in my name,
which I have not command him to speak, or that shall speak in the
nam of other gods, even that prophet shall die.

18:21 and if thou say in thine heart, how shall we know the word which
th lord hath not spoken?  18:22 when a prophet speaketh in the name
of the lord, if the thing follow not, nor come to pass, that is the
th which the lord hath not spoken, but the prophet hath spoken it
presumptuously: thou shalt not be afraid of him.

19:1 when the lord thi god hath cut off the nations, whose land the
lord thi god giveth thee, and thou succeedest them, and dwellest in
their cities, and in their houses; 19:2 thou shalt separ three
citi for thee in the midst of thi land, which the lord thi god
giveth thee to possess it.

19:3 thou shalt prepar thee a way, and divid the coast of thi land,
which the lord thi god giveth thee to inherit, into three parts, that
everi slayer may flee thither.

19:4 and thi is the case of the slayer, which shall flee thither,
that he may live: whoso killeth hi neighbour ignorantly, whom he
hat not in time past; 19:5 As when a man goeth into the wood with
hi neighbour to hew wood, and hi hand fetcheth a stroke with the axe
to cut down the tree, and the head slippeth from the helve, and
lighteth upon hi neighbour, that he die; he shall flee unto one of
thos cities, and live: 19:6 lest the aveng of the blood pursu the
slayer, while hi heart is hot, and overtak him, becaus the way is
long, and slay him; wherea he wa not worthi of death, inasmuch as he
hat him not in time past.

19:7 wherefor I command thee, saying, thou shalt separ three
citi for thee.

19:8 and if the lord thi god enlarg thi coast, as he hath sworn unto
thi fathers, and give thee all the land which he promis to give unto
thi fathers; 19:9 If thou shalt keep all these command to do
them, which I command thee thi day, to love the lord thi god, and to
walk ever in hi ways; then shalt thou add three citi more for thee,
besid these three: 19:10 that innoc blood be not shed in thi land,
which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance, and so blood be
upon thee.

19:11 but if ani man hate hi neighbour, and lie in wait for him, and
ris up against him, and smite him mortal that he die, and fleeth
into one of these cities: 19:12 then the elder of hi citi shall send
and fetch him thence, and deliv him into the hand of the aveng of
blood, that he may die.

19:13 thine eye shall not piti him, but thou shalt put away the guilt
of innoc blood from israel, that it may go well with thee.

19:14 thou shalt not remov thi neighbour' landmark, which they of
old time have set in thine inheritance, which thou shalt inherit in
th land that the lord thi god giveth thee to possess it.

19:15 one wit shall not rise up against a man for ani iniquity, or
for ani sin, in ani sin that he sinneth: at the mouth of two
witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses, shall the matter be
established.

19:16 If a fals wit rise up against ani man to testifi against
him that which is wrong; 19:17 then both the men, between whom the
controversi is, shall stand befor the lord, befor the priest and
th judges, which shall be in those days; 19:18 and the judg shall
mak dilig inquisition: and, behold, if the wit be a false
witness, and hath testifi fals against hi brother; 19:19 then
shal ye do unto him, as he had thought to have done unto hi brother:
so shalt thou put the evil away from among you.

19:20 and those which remain shall hear, and fear, and shall
henceforth commit no more ani such evil among you.

19:21 and thine eye shall not pity; but life shall go for life, eye
for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

20:1 when thou goest out to battl against thine enemies, and seest
horses, and chariots, and a peopl more than thou, be not afraid of
them: for the lord thi god is with thee, which brought thee up out of
th land of egypt.

20:2 and it shall be, when ye are come nigh unto the battle, that the
priest shall approach and speak unto the people, 20:3 and shall say
unto them, hear, O israel, ye approach thi day unto battl against
your enemies: let not your heart faint, fear not, and do not tremble,
neith be ye terrifi becaus of them; 20:4 for the lord your god is
h that goeth with you, to fight for you against your enemies, to save
you.

20:5 and the offic shall speak unto the people, saying, what man is
ther that hath built a new house, and hath not dedic it? let him
go and return to hi house, lest he die in the battle, and anoth man
ded it.

20:6 and what man is he that hath plant a vineyard, and hath not yet
eaten of it? let him also go and return unto hi house, lest he die in
th battle, and anoth man eat of it.

20:7 and what man is there that hath betroth a wife, and hath not
taken her? let him go and return unto hi house, lest he die in the
battle, and anoth man take her.

20:8 and the offic shall speak further unto the people, and they
shal say, what man is there that is fear and fainthearted? let him
go and return unto hi house, lest hi brethren' heart faint as well
a hi heart.

20:9 and it shall be, when the offic have made an end of speaking
unto the peopl that they shall make captain of the armi to lead
th people.

20:10 when thou comest nigh unto a citi to fight against it, then
proclaim peac unto it.

20:11 and it shall be, if it make thee answer of peace, and open unto
thee, then it shall be, that all the peopl that is found therein
shal be tributari unto thee, and they shall serv thee.

20:12 and if it will make no peac with thee, but will make war
against thee, then thou shalt besieg it: 20:13 and when the lord thy
god hath deliv it into thine hands, thou shalt smite everi male
thereof with the edg of the sword: 20:14 but the women, and the
littl ones, and the cattle, and all that is in the city, even all the
spoil thereof, shalt thou take unto thyself; and thou shalt eat the
spoil of thine enemies, which the lord thi god hath given thee.

20:15 thu shalt thou do unto all the citi which are veri far off
from thee, which are not of the citi of these nations.

20:16 but of the citi of these people, which the lord thi god doth
giv thee for an inheritance, thou shalt save aliv noth that
breatheth: 20:17 but thou shalt utterli destroy them; namely, the
hittites, and the amorites, the canaanites, and the perizzites, the
hivites, and the jebusites; as the lord thi god hath command thee:
20:18 that they teach you not to do after all their abominations,
which they have done unto their gods; so should ye sin against the
lord your god.

20:19 when thou shalt besieg a citi a long time, in make war
against it to take it, thou shalt not destroy the tree thereof by
forc an axe against them: for thou mayest eat of them, and thou
shalt not cut them down (for the tree of the field is man' life) to
employ them in the siege: 20:20 onli the tree which thou knowest that
they be not tree for meat, thou shalt destroy and cut them down; and
thou shalt build bulwark against the citi that maketh war with thee,
until it be subdued.

21:1 If one be found slain in the land which the lord thi god giveth
the to possess it, lie in the field, and it be not known who hath
slain him: 21:2 then thi elder and thi judg shall come forth, and
they shall measur unto the citi which are round about him that is
slain: 21:3 and it shall be, that the citi which is next unto the
slain man, even the elder of that citi shall take an heifer, which
hath not been wrought with, and which hath not drawn in the yoke; 21:4
and the elder of that citi shall bring down the heifer unto a rough
valley, which is neither ear nor sown, and shall strike off the
heifer' neck there in the valley: 21:5 and the priest the son of
levi shall come near; for them the lord thi god hath chosen to
minist unto him, and to bless in the name of the lord; and by their
word shall everi controversi and everi stroke be tried: 21:6 and all
th elder of that city, that are next unto the slain man, shall wash
their hand over the heifer that is behead in the valley: 21:7 and
they shall answer and say, our hand have not shed thi blood, neither
hav our eye seen it.

21:8 Be merciful, O lord, unto thi peopl israel, whom thou hast
redeemed, and lay not innoc blood unto thi peopl of israel's
charge. and the blood shall be forgiven them.

21:9 So shalt thou put away the guilt of innoc blood from among
you, when thou shalt do that which is right in the sight of the lord.

21:10 when thou goest forth to war against thine enemies, and the lord
thi god hath deliv them into thine hands, and thou hast taken them
captive, 21:11 and seest among the captiv a beauti woman, and
hast a desir unto her, that thou wouldest have her to thi wife; 21:12
then thou shalt bring her home to thine house, and she shall shave her
head, and pare her nails; 21:13 and she shall put the raiment of her
capt from off her, and shall remain in thine house, and bewail
h father and her mother a full month: and after that thou shalt go
in unto her, and be her husband, and she shall be thi wife.

21:14 and it shall be, if thou have no delight in her, then thou shalt
let her go whither she will; but thou shalt not sell her at all for
money, thou shalt not make merchandis of her, becaus thou hast
humbl her.

21:15 If a man have two wives, one beloved, and anoth hated, and
they have born him children, both the belov and the hated; and if
th firstborn son be her that wa hated: 21:16 then it shall be, when
h maketh hi son to inherit that which he hath, that he may not make
th son of the belov firstborn befor the son of the hated, which is
inde the firstborn: 21:17 but he shall acknowledg the son of the
hat for the firstborn, by give him a doubl portion of all that he
hath: for he is the begin of hi strength; the right of the
firstborn is his.

21:18 If a man have a stubborn and rebelli son, which will not obey
th voic of hi father, or the voic of hi mother, and that, when
they have chasten him, will not hearken unto them: 21:19 then shall
hi father and hi mother lay hold on him, and bring him out unto the
eld of hi city, and unto the gate of hi place; 21:20 and they
shal say unto the elder of hi city, thi our son is stubborn and
rebellious, he will not obey our voice; he is a glutton, and a
drunkard.

21:21 and all the men of hi citi shall stone him with stones, that he
die: so shalt thou put evil away from among you; and all israel shall
hear, and fear.

21:22 and if a man have commit a sin worthi of death, and he be to
b put to death, and thou hang him on a tree: 21:23 hi bodi shall not
remain all night upon the tree, but thou shalt in ani wise buri him
that day; (for he that is hang is accurs of god;) that thi land be
not defiled, which the lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance.

22:1 thou shalt not see thi brother' ox or hi sheep go astray, and
hid thyself from them: thou shalt in ani case bring them again unto
thi brother.

22:2 and if thi brother be not nigh unto thee, or if thou know him
not, then thou shalt bring it unto thine own house, and it shall be
with thee until thi brother seek after it, and thou shalt restor it
to him again.

22:3 In like manner shalt thou do with hi ass; and so shalt thou do
with hi raiment; and with all lost thing of thi brother's, which he
hath lost, and thou hast found, shalt thou do likewise: thou mayest
not hide thyself.

22:4 thou shalt not see thi brother' ass or hi ox fall down by the
way, and hide thyself from them: thou shalt sure help him to lift
them up again.

22:5 the woman shall not wear that which pertaineth unto a man,
neith shall a man put on a woman' garment: for all that do so are
abomin unto the lord thi god.

22:6 If a bird' nest chanc to be befor thee in the way in ani tree,
or on the ground, whether they be young ones, or eggs, and the dam
sit upon the young, or upon the eggs, thou shalt not take the dam
with the young: 22:7 but thou shalt in ani wise let the dam go, and
tak the young to thee; that it may be well with thee, and that thou
mayest prolong thi days.

22:8 when thou buildest a new house, then thou shalt make a battlement
for thi roof, that thou bring not blood upon thine house, if ani man
fal from thence.

22:9 thou shalt not sow thi vineyard with diver seeds: lest the fruit
of thi seed which thou hast sown, and the fruit of thi vineyard, be
defiled.

22:10 thou shalt not plow with an ox and an ass together.

22:11 thou shalt not wear a garment of diver sorts, as of woollen and
linen together.

22:12 thou shalt make thee fring upon the four quarter of thy
vesture, wherewith thou coverest thyself.

22:13 If ani man take a wife, and go in unto her, and hate her, 22:14
and give occas of speech against her, and bring up an evil name
upon her, and say, I took thi woman, and when I came to her, I found
her not a maid: 22:15 then shall the father of the damsel, and her
mother, take and bring forth the token of the damsel' virgin unto
th elder of the citi in the gate: 22:16 and the damsel' father
shal say unto the elders, I gave my daughter unto thi man to wife,
and he hateth her; 22:17 and, lo, he hath given occas of speech
against her, saying, I found not thi daughter a maid; and yet these
ar the token of my daughter' virginity. and they shall spread the
cloth befor the elder of the city.

22:18 and the elder of that citi shall take that man and chastise
him; 22:19 and they shall amerc him in an hundr shekel of silver,
and give them unto the father of the damsel, becaus he hath brought
up an evil name upon a virgin of israel: and she shall be hi wife; he
may not put her away all hi days.

22:20 but if thi thing be true, and the token of virgin be not
found for the damsel: 22:21 then they shall bring out the damsel to
th door of her father' house, and the men of her citi shall stone
h with stone that she die: becaus she hath wrought folli in
israel, to play the whore in her father' house: so shalt thou put
evil away from among you.

22:22 If a man be found lie with a woman marri to an husband, then
they shall both of them die, both the man that lay with the woman, and
th woman: so shalt thou put away evil from israel.

22:23 If a damsel that is a virgin be betroth unto an husband, and a
man find her in the city, and lie with her; 22:24 then ye shall bring
them both out unto the gate of that city, and ye shall stone them with
ston that they die; the damsel, becaus she cri not, be in the
city; and the man, becaus he hath humbl hi neighbour' wife: so
thou shalt put away evil from among you.

22:25 but if a man find a betroth damsel in the field, and the man
forc her, and lie with her: then the man onli that lay with her shall
die.

22:26 but unto the damsel thou shalt do nothing; there is in the
damsel no sin worthi of death: for as when a man riseth against his
neighbour, and slayeth him, even so is thi matter: 22:27 for he found
her in the field, and the betroth damsel cried, and there wa none
to save her.

22:28 If a man find a damsel that is a virgin, which is not betrothed,
and lay hold on her, and lie with her, and they be found; 22:29 then
th man that lay with her shall give unto the damsel' father fifty
shekel of silver, and she shall be hi wife; becaus he hath humbled
her, he may not put her away all hi days.

22:30 A man shall not take hi father' wife, nor discov his
father' skirt.

23:1 He that is wound in the stones, or hath hi privi member cut
off, shall not enter into the congreg of the lord.

23:2 A bastard shall not enter into the congreg of the lord; even
to hi tenth gener shall he not enter into the congreg of
th lord.

23:3 An ammonit or moabit shall not enter into the congreg of
th lord; even to their tenth gener shall they not enter into the
congreg of the lord for ever: 23:4 becaus they met you not with
bread and with water in the way, when ye came forth out of egypt; and
becaus they hire against thee balaam the son of beor of pethor of
mesopotamia, to curs thee.

23:5 nevertheless the lord thi god would not hearken unto balaam; but
th lord thi god turn the curs into a bless unto thee, because
th lord thi god love thee.

23:6 thou shalt not seek their peac nor their prosper all thi days
for ever.

23:7 thou shalt not abhor an edomite; for he is thi brother: thou
shalt not abhor an egyptian; becaus thou wast a stranger in hi land.

23:8 the children that are begotten of them shall enter into the
congreg of the lord in their third generation.

23:9 when the host goeth forth against thine enemies, then keep thee
from everi wick thing.

23:10 If there be among you ani man, that is not clean by reason of
unclean that chanceth him by night, then shall he go abroad out of
th camp, he shall not come within the camp: 23:11 but it shall be,
when even cometh on, he shall wash himself with water: and when the
sun is down, he shall come into the camp again.

23:12 thou shalt have a place also without the camp, whither thou
shalt go forth abroad: 23:13 and thou shalt have a paddl upon thy
weapon; and it shall be, when thou wilt eas thyself abroad, thou
shalt dig therewith, and shalt turn back and cover that which cometh
from thee: 23:14 for the lord thi god walketh in the midst of thy
camp, to deliv thee, and to give up thine enemi befor thee;
therefor shall thi camp be holy: that he see no unclean thing in
thee, and turn away from thee.

23:15 thou shalt not deliv unto hi master the servant which is
escap from hi master unto thee: 23:16 He shall dwell with thee,
even among you, in that place which he shall choos in one of thy
gates, where it liketh him best: thou shalt not oppress him.

23:17 there shall be no whore of the daughter of israel, nor a
sodomit of the son of israel.

23:18 thou shalt not bring the hire of a whore, or the price of a dog,
into the hous of the lord thi god for ani vow: for even both these
ar abomin unto the lord thi god.

23:19 thou shalt not lend upon usuri to thi brother; usuri of money,
usuri of victuals, usuri of ani thing that is lent upon usury: 23:20
unto a stranger thou mayest lend upon usury; but unto thi brother thou
shalt not lend upon usury: that the lord thi god may bless thee in all
that thou settest thine hand to in the land whither thou goest to
possess it.

23:21 when thou shalt vow a vow unto the lord thi god, thou shalt not
slack to pay it: for the lord thi god will sure requir it of thee;
and it would be sin in thee.

23:22 but if thou shalt forbear to vow, it shall be no sin in thee.

23:23 that which is gone out of thi lip thou shalt keep and perform;
even a freewil offering, accord as thou hast vow unto the lord
thi god, which thou hast promis with thi mouth.

23:24 when thou comest into thi neighbour' vineyard, then thou mayest
eat grape thi fill at thine own pleasure; but thou shalt not put any
in thi vessel.

23:25 when thou comest into the stand corn of thi neighbour, then
thou mayest pluck the ear with thine hand; but thou shalt not move a
sickl unto thi neighbour' stand corn.

24:1 when a man hath taken a wife, and marri her, and it come to
pass that she find no favour in hi eyes, becaus he hath found some
unclean in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement, and
giv it in her hand, and send her out of hi house.

24:2 and when she is depart out of hi house, she may go and be
anoth man' wife.

24:3 and if the latter husband hate her, and write her a bill of
divorcement, and giveth it in her hand, and sendeth her out of his
house; or if the latter husband die, which took her to be hi wife;
24:4 her former husband, which sent her away, may not take her again
to be hi wife, after that she is defiled; for that is abomination
befor the lord: and thou shalt not caus the land to sin, which the
lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance.

24:5 when a man hath taken a new wife, he shall not go out to war,
neith shall he be charg with ani business: but he shall be free at
hom one year, and shall cheer up hi wife which he hath taken.

24:6 No man shall take the nether or the upper millston to pledge:
for he taketh a man' life to pledge.

24:7 If a man be found steal ani of hi brethren of the children of
israel, and maketh merchandis of him, or selleth him; then that thief
shal die; and thou shalt put evil away from among you.

24:8 take heed in the plagu of leprosy, that thou observ diligently,
and do accord to all that the priest the levit shall teach you:
a I command them, so ye shall observ to do.

24:9 rememb what the lord thi god did unto miriam by the way, after
that ye were come forth out of egypt.

24:10 when thou dost lend thi brother ani thing, thou shalt not go
into hi hous to fetch hi pledge.

24:11 thou shalt stand abroad, and the man to whom thou dost lend
shal bring out the pledg abroad unto thee.

24:12 and if the man be poor, thou shalt not sleep with hi pledge:
24:13 In ani case thou shalt deliv him the pledg again when the sun
goeth down, that he may sleep in hi own raiment, and bless thee: and
it shall be righteous unto thee befor the lord thi god.

24:14 thou shalt not oppress an hire servant that is poor and needy,
wheth he be of thi brethren, or of thi stranger that are in thy
land within thi gates: 24:15 At hi day thou shalt give him hi hire,
neith shall the sun go down upon it; for he is poor, and setteth his
heart upon it: lest he cri against thee unto the lord, and it be sin
unto thee.

24:16 the father shall not be put to death for the children, neither
shal the children be put to death for the fathers: everi man shall be
put to death for hi own sin.

24:17 thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger, nor of the
fatherless; nor take a widow' raiment to pledge: 24:18 but thou shalt
rememb that thou wast a bondman in egypt, and the lord thi god
redeem thee thence: therefor I command thee to do thi thing.

24:19 when thou cuttest down thine harvest in thi field, and hast
forgot a sheaf in the field, thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it
shal be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and for the widow: that
th lord thi god may bless thee in all the work of thine hands.

24:20 when thou beatest thine oliv tree, thou shalt not go over the
bough again: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless, and
for the widow.

24:21 when thou gatherest the grape of thi vineyard, thou shalt not
glean it afterward: it shall be for the stranger, for the fatherless,
and for the widow.

24:22 and thou shalt rememb that thou wast a bondman in the land of
egypt: therefor I command thee to do thi thing.

25:1 If there be a controversi between men, and they come unto
judgment, that the judg may judg them; then they shall justifi the
righteous, and condemn the wicked.

25:2 and it shall be, if the wick man be worthi to be beaten, that
th judg shall caus him to lie down, and to be beaten befor his
face, accord to hi fault, by a certain number.

25:3 forti stripe he may give him, and not exceed: lest, if he should
exceed, and beat him abov these with mani stripes, then thi brother
should seem vile unto thee.

25:4 thou shalt not muzzl the ox when he treadeth out the corn.

25:5 If brethren dwell together, and one of them die, and have no
child, the wife of the dead shall not marri without unto a stranger:
h husband' brother shall go in unto her, and take her to him to
wife, and perform the duti of an husband' brother unto her.

25:6 and it shall be, that the firstborn which she beareth shall
succe in the name of hi brother which is dead, that hi name be not
put out of israel.

25:7 and if the man like not to take hi brother' wife, then let his
brother' wife go up to the gate unto the elders, and say, my
husband' brother refuseth to rais up unto hi brother a name in
israel, he will not perform the duti of my husband' brother.

25:8 then the elder of hi citi shall call him, and speak unto him:
and if he stand to it, and say, I like not to take her; 25:9 then
shal hi brother' wife come unto him in the presenc of the elders,
and loos hi shoe from off hi foot, and spit in hi face, and shall
answ and say, So shall it be done unto that man that will not build
up hi brother' house.

25:10 and hi name shall be call in israel, the hous of him that
hath hi shoe loosed.

25:11 when men strive togeth one with another, and the wife of the
on draweth near for to deliv her husband out of the hand of him
that smiteth him, and putteth forth her hand, and taketh him by the
secrets: 25:12 then thou shalt cut off her hand, thine eye shall not
piti her.

25:13 thou shalt not have in thi bag diver weights, a great and a
small.

25:14 thou shalt not have in thine hous diver measures, a great and
a small.

25:15 but thou shalt have a perfect and just weight, a perfect and
just measur shalt thou have: that thi day may be lengthen in the
land which the lord thi god giveth thee.

25:16 for all that do such things, and all that do unrighteously, are
an abomin unto the lord thi god.

25:17 rememb what amalek did unto thee by the way, when ye were come
forth out of egypt; 25:18 how he met thee by the way, and smote the
hindmost of thee, even all that were feebl behind thee, when thou
wast faint and weary; and he fear not god.

25:19 therefor it shall be, when the lord thi god hath given thee
rest from all thine enemi round about, in the land which the lord
thi god giveth thee for an inherit to possess it, that thou shalt
blot out the remembr of amalek from under heaven; thou shalt not
forget it.

26:1 and it shall be, when thou art come in unto the land which the
lord thi god giveth thee for an inheritance, and possessest it, and
dwellest therein; 26:2 that thou shalt take of the first of all the
fruit of the earth, which thou shalt bring of thi land that the lord
thi god giveth thee, and shalt put it in a basket, and shalt go unto
th place which the lord thi god shall choos to place hi name there.

26:3 and thou shalt go unto the priest that shall be in those days,
and say unto him, I profess thi day unto the lord thi god, that I am
com unto the countri which the lord sware unto our father for to
giv us.

26:4 and the priest shall take the basket out of thine hand, and set
it down befor the altar of the lord thi god.

26:5 and thou shalt speak and say befor the lord thi god, A syrian
readi to perish wa my father, and he went down into egypt, and
sojourn there with a few, and becam there a nation, great, mighty,
and populous: 26:6 and the egyptian evil entreat us, and afflicted
us, and laid upon us hard bondage: 26:7 and when we cri unto the
lord god of our fathers, the lord heard our voice, and look on our
affliction, and our labour, and our oppression: 26:8 and the lord
brought us forth out of egypt with a mighti hand, and with an
outstretch arm, and with great terribleness, and with signs, and
with wonders: 26:9 and he hath brought us into thi place, and hath
given us thi land, even a land that floweth with milk and honey.

26:10 and now, behold, I have brought the firstfruit of the land,
which thou, O lord, hast given me. and thou shalt set it befor the
lord thi god, and worship befor the lord thi god: 26:11 and thou
shalt rejoic in everi good thing which the lord thi god hath given
unto thee, and unto thine house, thou, and the levite, and the
strang that is among you.

26:12 when thou hast made an end of tith all the tith of thine
increas the third year, which is the year of tithing, and hast given
it unto the levite, the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, that
they may eat within thi gates, and be filled; 26:13 then thou shalt
say befor the lord thi god, I have brought away the hallow things
out of mine house, and also have given them unto the levite, and unto
th stranger, to the fatherless, and to the widow, accord to all
thi command which thou hast command me: I have not transgressed
thi commandments, neither have I forgotten them.

26:14 I have not eaten thereof in my mourning, neither have I taken
away ought thereof for ani unclean use, nor given ought thereof for
th dead: but I have hearken to the voic of the lord my god, and
hav done accord to all that thou hast command me.

26:15 look down from thi holi habitation, from heaven, and bless thy
peopl israel, and the land which thou hast given us, as thou swarest
unto our fathers, a land that floweth with milk and honey.

26:16 thi day the lord thi god hath command thee to do these
statut and judgments: thou shalt therefor keep and do them with all
thin heart, and with all thi soul.

26:17 thou hast avouch the lord thi day to be thi god, and to walk
in hi ways, and to keep hi statutes, and hi commandments, and his
judgments, and to hearken unto hi voice: 26:18 and the lord hath
avouch thee thi day to be hi peculiar people, as he hath promised
thee, and that thou shouldest keep all hi commandments; 26:19 and to
mak thee high abov all nation which he hath made, in praise, and in
name, and in honour; and that thou mayest be an holi peopl unto the
lord thi god, as he hath spoken.

27:1 and mose with the elder of israel command the people, saying,
keep all the command which I command you thi day.

27:2 and it shall be on the day when ye shall pass over jordan unto
th land which the lord thi god giveth thee, that thou shalt set thee
up great stones, and plaister them with plaister: 27:3 and thou shalt
writ upon them all the word of thi law, when thou art pass over,
that thou mayest go in unto the land which the lord thi god giveth
thee, a land that floweth with milk and honey; as the lord god of thy
fath hath promis thee.

27:4 therefor it shall be when ye be gone over jordan, that ye shall
set up these stones, which I command you thi day, in mount ebal, and
thou shalt plaister them with plaister.

27:5 and there shalt thou build an altar unto the lord thi god, an
altar of stones: thou shalt not lift up ani iron tool upon them.

27:6 thou shalt build the altar of the lord thi god of whole stones:
and thou shalt offer burnt offer thereon unto the lord thi god:
27:7 and thou shalt offer peac offerings, and shalt eat there, and
rejoic befor the lord thi god.

27:8 and thou shalt write upon the stone all the word of thi law
veri plainly.

27:9 and mose and the priest the levit spake unto all israel,
saying, take heed, and hearken, O israel; thi day thou art becom the
peopl of the lord thi god.

27:10 thou shalt therefor obey the voic of the lord thi god, and do
hi command and hi statutes, which I command thee thi day.

27:11 and mose charg the peopl the same day, saying, 27:12 these
shal stand upon mount gerizim to bless the people, when ye are come
ov jordan; simeon, and levi, and judah, and issachar, and joseph,
and benjamin: 27:13 and these shall stand upon mount ebal to curse;
reuben, gad, and asher, and zebulun, dan, and naphtali.

27:14 and the levit shall speak, and say unto all the men of israel
with a loud voice, 27:15 curs be the man that maketh ani graven or
molten image, an abomin unto the lord, the work of the hand of
th craftsman, and putteth it in a secret place. and all the people
shal answer and say, amen.

27:16 curs be he that setteth light by hi father or hi mother. and
al the peopl shall say, amen.

27:17 curs be he that removeth hi neighbour' landmark. and all the
peopl shall say, amen.

27:18 curs be he that maketh the blind to wander out of the way. and
al the peopl shall say, amen.

27:19 curs be he that perverteth the judgment of the stranger,
fatherless, and widow. and all the peopl shall say, amen.

27:20 curs be he that lieth with hi father' wife; becaus he
uncovereth hi father' skirt. and all the peopl shall say, amen.

27:21 curs be he that lieth with ani manner of beast. and all the
peopl shall say, amen.

27:22 curs be he that lieth with hi sister, the daughter of his
father, or the daughter of hi mother. and all the peopl shall say,
amen.

27:23 curs be he that lieth with hi mother in law. and all the
peopl shall say, amen.

27:24 curs be he that smiteth hi neighbour secretly. and all the
peopl shall say, amen.

27:25 curs be he that taketh reward to slay an innoc person. and
al the peopl shall say, amen.

27:26 curs be he that confirmeth not all the word of thi law to do
them. and all the peopl shall say, amen.

28:1 and it shall come to pass, if thou shalt hearken dilig unto
th voic of the lord thi god, to observ and to do all his
command which I command thee thi day, that the lord thi god will
set thee on high abov all nation of the earth: 28:2 and all these
bless shall come on thee, and overtak thee, if thou shalt hearken
unto the voic of the lord thi god.

28:3 bless shalt thou be in the city, and bless shalt thou be in
th field.

28:4 bless shall be the fruit of thi body, and the fruit of thy
ground, and the fruit of thi cattle, the increas of thi kine, and the
flock of thi sheep.

28:5 bless shall be thi basket and thi store.

28:6 bless shalt thou be when thou comest in, and bless shalt thou
b when thou goest out.

28:7 the lord shall caus thine enemi that rise up against thee to
b smitten befor thi face: they shall come out against thee one way,
and flee befor thee seven ways.

28:8 the lord shall command the bless upon thee in thi storehouses,
and in all that thou settest thine hand unto; and he shall bless thee
in the land which the lord thi god giveth thee.

28:9 the lord shall establish thee an holi peopl unto himself, as he
hath sworn unto thee, if thou shalt keep the command of the lord
thi god, and walk in hi ways.

28:10 and all peopl of the earth shall see that thou art call by
th name of the lord; and they shall be afraid of thee.

28:11 and the lord shall make thee plenteou in goods, in the fruit of
thi body, and in the fruit of thi cattle, and in the fruit of thy
ground, in the land which the lord sware unto thi father to give
thee.

28:12 the lord shall open unto thee hi good treasure, the heaven to
giv the rain unto thi land in hi season, and to bless all the work
of thine hand: and thou shalt lend unto mani nations, and thou shalt
not borrow.

28:13 and the lord shall make thee the head, and not the tail; and
thou shalt be abov only, and thou shalt not be beneath; if that thou
hearken unto the command of the lord thi god, which I command
the thi day, to observ and to do them: 28:14 and thou shalt not go
asid from ani of the word which I command thee thi day, to the
right hand, or to the left, to go after other god to serv them.

28:15 but it shall come to pass, if thou wilt not hearken unto the
voic of the lord thi god, to observ to do all hi command and
hi statut which I command thee thi day; that all these curses
shal come upon thee, and overtak thee: 28:16 curs shalt thou be in
th city, and curs shalt thou be in the field.

28:17 curs shall be thi basket and thi store.

28:18 curs shall be the fruit of thi body, and the fruit of thy
land, the increas of thi kine, and the flock of thi sheep.

28:19 curs shalt thou be when thou comest in, and curs shalt thou
b when thou goest out.

28:20 the lord shall send upon thee cursing, vexation, and rebuke, in
al that thou settest thine hand unto for to do, until thou be
destroyed, and until thou perish quickly; becaus of the wicked of
thi doings, wherebi thou hast forsaken me.

28:21 the lord shall make the pestil cleav unto thee, until he
hav consum thee from off the land, whither thou goest to possess
it.

28:22 the lord shall smite thee with a consumption, and with a fever,
and with an inflammation, and with an extrem burning, and with the
sword, and with blasting, and with mildew; and they shall pursu thee
until thou perish.

28:23 and thi heaven that is over thi head shall be brass, and the
earth that is under thee shall be iron.

28:24 the lord shall make the rain of thi land powder and dust: from
heaven shall it come down upon thee, until thou be destroyed.

28:25 the lord shall caus thee to be smitten befor thine enemies:
th shalt go out one way against them, and flee seven way before
them: and shalt be remov into all the kingdom of the earth.

28:26 and thi carcas shall be meat unto all fowl of the air, and
unto the beast of the earth, and no man shall fray them away.

28:27 the lord will smite thee with the botch of egypt, and with the
emerods, and with the scab, and with the itch, whereof thou canst not
b healed.

28:28 the lord shall smite thee with madness, and blindness, and
astonish of heart: 28:29 and thou shalt grope at noonday, as the
blind gropeth in darkness, and thou shalt not prosper in thi ways: and
thou shalt be onli oppress and spoil evermore, and no man shall
sav thee.

28:30 thou shalt betroth a wife, and anoth man shall lie with her:
thou shalt build an house, and thou shalt not dwell therein: thou
shalt plant a vineyard, and shalt not gather the grape thereof.

28:31 thine ox shall be slain befor thine eyes, and thou shalt not
eat thereof: thine ass shall be violent taken away from befor thy
face, and shall not be restor to thee: thi sheep shall be given unto
thin enemies, and thou shalt have none to rescu them.

28:32 thi son and thi daughter shall be given unto anoth people,
and thine eye shall look, and fail with long for them all the day
long; and there shall be no might in thine hand.

28:33 the fruit of thi land, and all thi labours, shall a nation which
thou knowest not eat up; and thou shalt be onli oppress and crushed
alway: 28:34 So that thou shalt be mad for the sight of thine eyes
which thou shalt see.

28:35 the lord shall smite thee in the knees, and in the legs, with a
sor botch that cannot be healed, from the sole of thi foot unto the
top of thi head.

28:36 the lord shall bring thee, and thi king which thou shalt set
ov thee, unto a nation which neither thou nor thi father have
known; and there shalt thou serv other gods, wood and stone.

28:37 and thou shalt becom an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword,
among all nation whither the lord shall lead thee.

28:38 thou shalt carri much seed out into the field, and shalt gather
but littl in; for the locust shall consum it.

28:39 thou shalt plant vineyards, and dress them, but shalt neither
drink of the wine, nor gather the grapes; for the worm shall eat
them.

28:40 thou shalt have oliv tree throughout all thi coasts, but thou
shalt not anoint thyself with the oil; for thine oliv shall cast his
fruit.

28:41 thou shalt beget son and daughters, but thou shalt not enjoy
them; for they shall go into captivity.

28:42 all thi tree and fruit of thi land shall the locust consume.

28:43 the stranger that is within thee shall get up abov thee very
high; and thou shalt come down veri low.

28:44 He shall lend to thee, and thou shalt not lend to him: he shall
b the head, and thou shalt be the tail.

28:45 moreov all these curs shall come upon thee, and shall pursue
thee, and overtak thee, till thou be destroyed; becaus thou
hearkenedst not unto the voic of the lord thi god, to keep his
command and hi statut which he command thee: 28:46 and they
shal be upon thee for a sign and for a wonder, and upon thi seed for
ever.

28:47 becaus thou servedst not the lord thi god with joyfulness, and
with glad of heart, for the abund of all things; 28:48
therefor shalt thou serv thine enemi which the lord shall send
against thee, in hunger, and in thirst, and in nakedness, and in want
of all things: and he shall put a yoke of iron upon thi neck, until he
hav destroy thee.

28:49 the lord shall bring a nation against thee from far, from the
end of the earth, as swift as the eagl flieth; a nation whose tongue
th shalt not understand; 28:50 A nation of fierc countenance, which
shal not regard the person of the old, nor shew favour to the young:
28:51 and he shall eat the fruit of thi cattle, and the fruit of thy
land, until thou be destroyed: which also shall not leav thee either
corn, wine, or oil, or the increas of thi kine, or flock of thy
sheep, until he have destroy thee.

28:52 and he shall besieg thee in all thi gates, until thi high and
fenc wall come down, wherein thou trustedst, throughout all thy
land: and he shall besieg thee in all thi gate throughout all thy
land, which the lord thi god hath given thee.

28:53 and thou shalt eat the fruit of thine own body, the flesh of thy
son and of thi daughters, which the lord thi god hath given thee, in
th siege, and in the straitness, wherewith thine enemi shall
distress thee: 28:54 So that the man that is tender among you, and
veri delicate, hi eye shall be evil toward hi brother, and toward
th wife of hi bosom, and toward the remnant of hi children which he
shal leave: 28:55 So that he will not give to ani of them of the
flesh of hi children whom he shall eat: becaus he hath noth left
him in the siege, and in the straitness, wherewith thine enemi shall
distress thee in all thi gates.

28:56 the tender and delic woman among you, which would not
adventur to set the sole of her foot upon the ground for delicateness
and tenderness, her eye shall be evil toward the husband of her bosom,
and toward her son, and toward her daughter, 28:57 and toward her
young one that cometh out from between her feet, and toward her
children which she shall bear: for she shall eat them for want of all
th secretli in the sieg and straitness, wherewith thine enemy
shal distress thee in thi gates.

28:58 If thou wilt not observ to do all the word of thi law that
ar written in thi book, that thou mayest fear thi gloriou and
fear name, the lord thi god; 28:59 then the lord will make thy
plagu wonderful, and the plagu of thi seed, even great plagues,
and of long continuance, and sore sicknesses, and of long continuance.

28:60 moreov he will bring upon thee all the diseas of egypt,
which thou wast afraid of; and they shall cleav unto thee.

28:61 also everi sickness, and everi plague, which is not written in
th book of thi law, them will the lord bring upon thee, until thou
b destroyed.

28:62 and ye shall be left few in number, wherea ye were as the stars
of heaven for multitude; becaus thou wouldest not obey the voic of
th lord thi god.

28:63 and it shall come to pass, that as the lord rejoic over you to
do you good, and to multipli you; so the lord will rejoic over you to
destroy you, and to bring you to nought; and ye shall be pluck from
off the land whither thou goest to possess it.

28:64 and the lord shall scatter thee among all people, from the one
end of the earth even unto the other; and there thou shalt serv other
gods, which neither thou nor thi father have known, even wood and
stone.

28:65 and among these nation shalt thou find no ease, neither shall
th sole of thi foot have rest: but the lord shall give thee there a
trembl heart, and fail of eyes, and sorrow of mind: 28:66 and
thi life shall hang in doubt befor thee; and thou shalt fear day and
night, and shalt have none assur of thi life: 28:67 In the morning
th shalt say, would god it were even! and at even thou shalt say,
would god it were morning! for the fear of thine heart wherewith thou
shalt fear, and for the sight of thine eye which thou shalt see.

28:68 and the lord shall bring thee into egypt again with ships, by
th way whereof I spake unto thee, thou shalt see it no more again:
and there ye shall be sold unto your enemi for bondmen and
bondwomen, and no man shall buy you.

29:1 these are the word of the covenant, which the lord commanded
mos to make with the children of israel in the land of moab, beside
th coven which he made with them in horeb.
