29:2 and mose call unto all israel, and said unto them, Ye have
seen all that the lord did befor your eye in the land of egypt unto
pharaoh, and unto all hi servants, and unto all hi land; 29:3 the
great temptat which thine eye have seen, the signs, and those
great miracles: 29:4 yet the lord hath not given you an heart to
perceive, and eye to see, and ear to hear, unto thi day.

29:5 and I have led you forti year in the wilderness: your clothes
ar not waxen old upon you, and thi shoe is not waxen old upon thy
foot.

29:6 Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong
drink: that ye might know that I am the lord your god.

29:7 and when ye came unto thi place, sihon the king of heshbon, and
og the king of bashan, came out against us unto battle, and we smote
them: 29:8 and we took their land, and gave it for an inherit unto
th reubenites, and to the gadites, and to the half tribe of manasseh.

29:9 keep therefor the word of thi covenant, and do them, that ye
may prosper in all that ye do.

29:10 Ye stand thi day all of you befor the lord your god; your
captain of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, with all the
men of israel, 29:11 your littl ones, your wives, and thi stranger
that is in thi camp, from the hewer of thi wood unto the drawer of thy
water: 29:12 that thou shouldest enter into coven with the lord thy
god, and into hi oath, which the lord thi god maketh with thee this
day: 29:13 that he may establish thee to day for a peopl unto
himself, and that he may be unto thee a god, as he hath said unto
thee, and as he hath sworn unto thi fathers, to abraham, to isaac, and
to jacob.

29:14 neither with you onli do I make thi coven and thi oath;
29:15 but with him that standeth here with us thi day befor the lord
our god, and also with him that is not here with us thi day: 29:16
(for ye know how we have dwelt in the land of egypt; and how we came
through the nation which ye pass by; 29:17 and ye have seen their
abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which
wer among them:) 29:18 lest there should be among you man, or woman,
or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away thi day from the lord
our god, to go and serv the god of these nations; lest there should
b among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood; 29:19 and it come
to pass, when he heareth the word of thi curse, that he bless
himself in hi heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the
imagin of mine heart, to add drunken to thirst: 29:20 the
lord will not spare him, but then the anger of the lord and his
jealousi shall smoke against that man, and all the curs that are
written in thi book shall lie upon him, and the lord shall blot out
hi name from under heaven.

29:21 and the lord shall separ him unto evil out of all the tribes
of israel, accord to all the curs of the coven that are
written in thi book of the law: 29:22 So that the gener to come
of your children that shall rise up after you, and the stranger that
shal come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagu of
that land, and the sick which the lord hath laid upon it; 29:23
and that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and burning,
that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor ani grass groweth therein, like
th overthrow of sodom, and gomorrah, admah, and zeboim, which the
lord overthrew in hi anger, and in hi wrath: 29:24 even all nations
shal say, wherefor hath the lord done thu unto thi land? what
meaneth the heat of thi great anger?  29:25 then men shall say,
becaus they have forsaken the coven of the lord god of their
fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the
land of egypt: 29:26 for they went and serv other gods, and
worship them, god whom they knew not, and whom he had not given
unto them: 29:27 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against this
land, to bring upon it all the curs that are written in thi book:
29:28 and the lord root them out of their land in anger, and in
wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into anoth land, as
it is thi day.

29:29 the secret thing belong unto the lord our god: but those things
which are reveal belong unto us and to our children for ever, that
w may do all the word of thi law.

30:1 and it shall come to pass, when all these thing are come upon
thee, the bless and the curse, which I have set befor thee, and
thou shalt call them to mind among all the nations, whither the lord
thi god hath driven thee, 30:2 and shalt return unto the lord thi god,
and shalt obey hi voic accord to all that I command thee this
day, thou and thi children, with all thine heart, and with all thy
soul; 30:3 that then the lord thi god will turn thi captivity, and
hav compass upon thee, and will return and gather thee from all
th nations, whither the lord thi god hath scatter thee.

30:4 If ani of thine be driven out unto the outmost part of heaven,
from thenc will the lord thi god gather thee, and from thenc will he
fetch thee: 30:5 and the lord thi god will bring thee into the land
which thi father possessed, and thou shalt possess it; and he will do
the good, and multipli thee abov thi fathers.

30:6 and the lord thi god will circumcis thine heart, and the heart
of thi seed, to love the lord thi god with all thine heart, and with
al thi soul, that thou mayest live.

30:7 and the lord thi god will put all these curs upon thine
enemies, and on them that hate thee, which persecut thee.

30:8 and thou shalt return and obey the voic of the lord, and do all
hi command which I command thee thi day.

30:9 and the lord thi god will make thee plenteou in everi work of
thin hand, in the fruit of thi body, and in the fruit of thi cattle,
and in the fruit of thi land, for good: for the lord will again
rejoic over thee for good, as he rejoic over thi fathers: 30:10 if
thou shalt hearken unto the voic of the lord thi god, to keep his
command and hi statut which are written in thi book of the
law, and if thou turn unto the lord thi god with all thine heart, and
with all thi soul.

30:11 for thi command which I command thee thi day, it is not
hidden from thee, neither is it far off.

30:12 It is not in heaven, that thou shouldest say, who shall go up
for us to heaven, and bring it unto us, that we may hear it, and do
it?  30:13 neither is it beyond the sea, that thou shouldest say, who
shal go over the sea for us, and bring it unto us, that we may hear
it, and do it?  30:14 but the word is veri nigh unto thee, in thy
mouth, and in thi heart, that thou mayest do it.

30:15 see, I have set befor thee thi day life and good, and death
and evil; 30:16 In that I command thee thi day to love the lord thy
god, to walk in hi ways, and to keep hi command and his
statut and hi judgments, that thou mayest live and multiply: and
th lord thi god shall bless thee in the land whither thou goest to
possess it.

30:17 but if thine heart turn away, so that thou wilt not hear, but
shalt be drawn away, and worship other gods, and serv them; 30:18 i
denounc unto you thi day, that ye shall sure perish, and that ye
shal not prolong your day upon the land, whither thou passest over
jordan to go to possess it.

30:19 I call heaven and earth to record thi day against you, that i
hav set befor you life and death, bless and cursing: therefore
choos life, that both thou and thi seed may live: 30:20 that thou
mayest love the lord thi god, and that thou mayest obey hi voice, and
that thou mayest cleav unto him: for he is thi life, and the length
of thi days: that thou mayest dwell in the land which the lord sware
unto thi fathers, to abraham, to isaac, and to jacob, to give them.

31:1 and mose went and spake these word unto all israel.

31:2 and he said unto them, I am an hundr and twenti year old this
day; I can no more go out and come in: also the lord hath said unto
me, thou shalt not go over thi jordan.

31:3 the lord thi god, he will go over befor thee, and he will
destroy these nation from befor thee, and thou shalt possess them:
and joshua, he shall go over befor thee, as the lord hath said.

31:4 and the lord shall do unto them as he did to sihon and to og,
k of the amorites, and unto the land of them, whom he destroyed.

31:5 and the lord shall give them up befor your face, that ye may do
unto them accord unto all the command which I have commanded
you.

31:6 Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them:
for the lord thi god, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not
fail thee, nor forsak thee.

31:7 and mose call unto joshua, and said unto him in the sight of
al israel, Be strong and of a good courage: for thou must go with
thi peopl unto the land which the lord hath sworn unto their fathers
to give them; and thou shalt caus them to inherit it.

31:8 and the lord, he it is that doth go befor thee; he will be with
thee, he will not fail thee, neither forsak thee: fear not, neither
b dismayed.

31:9 and mose wrote thi law, and deliv it unto the priest the
son of levi, which bare the ark of the coven of the lord, and unto
al the elder of israel.

31:10 and mose command them, saying, At the end of everi seven
years, in the solemn of the year of release, in the feast of
tabernacles, 31:11 when all israel is come to appear befor the lord
thi god in the place which he shall choose, thou shalt read thi law
befor all israel in their hearing.

31:12 gather the peopl together, men and women, and children, and thy
strang that is within thi gates, that they may hear, and that they
may learn, and fear the lord your god, and observ to do all the words
of thi law: 31:13 and that their children, which have not known any
thing, may hear, and learn to fear the lord your god, as long as ye
liv in the land whither ye go over jordan to possess it.

31:14 and the lord said unto moses, behold, thi day approach that
thou must die: call joshua, and present yourselv in the tabernacle
of the congregation, that I may give him a charge. and mose and
joshua went, and present themselv in the tabernacl of the
congregation.

31:15 and the lord appear in the tabernacl in a pillar of a cloud:
and the pillar of the cloud stood over the door of the tabernacle.

31:16 and the lord said unto moses, behold, thou shalt sleep with thy
fathers; and thi peopl will rise up, and go a whore after the gods
of the stranger of the land, whither they go to be among them, and
wil forsak me, and break my coven which I have made with them.

31:17 then my anger shall be kindl against them in that day, and i
wil forsak them, and I will hide my face from them, and they shall
b devoured, and mani evil and troubl shall befal them; so that
they will say in that day, are not these evil come upon us, because
our god is not among us?  31:18 and I will sure hide my face in that
day for all the evil which they shall have wrought, in that they are
turn unto other gods.

31:19 now therefor write ye thi song for you, and teach it the
children of israel: put it in their mouths, that thi song may be a
wit for me against the children of israel.

31:20 for when I shall have brought them into the land which I sware
unto their fathers, that floweth with milk and honey; and they shall
hav eaten and fill themselves, and waxen fat; then will they turn
unto other gods, and serv them, and provok me, and break my
covenant.

31:21 and it shall come to pass, when mani evil and troubl are
befallen them, that thi song shall testifi against them as a witness;
for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouth of their seed: for i
know their imagin which they go about, even now, befor I have
brought them into the land which I sware.

31:22 mose therefor wrote thi song the same day, and taught it the
children of israel.

31:23 and he gave joshua the son of nun a charge, and said, Be strong
and of a good courage: for thou shalt bring the children of israel
into the land which I sware unto them: and I will be with thee.

31:24 and it came to pass, when mose had made an end of write the
word of thi law in a book, until they were finished, 31:25 that
mos command the levites, which bare the ark of the coven of the
lord, saying, 31:26 take thi book of the law, and put it in the side
of the ark of the coven of the lord your god, that it may be there
for a wit against thee.

31:27 for I know thi rebellion, and thi stiff neck: behold, while I am
yet aliv with you thi day, ye have been rebelli against the lord;
and how much more after my death?  31:28 gather unto me all the elders
of your tribes, and your officers, that I may speak these word in
their ears, and call heaven and earth to record against them.

31:29 for I know that after my death ye will utterli corrupt
yourselves, and turn asid from the way which I have command you;
and evil will befal you in the latter days; becaus ye will do evil
in the sight of the lord, to provok him to anger through the work of
your hands.

31:30 and mose spake in the ear of all the congreg of israel
th word of thi song, until they were ended.

32:1 give ear, O ye heavens, and I will speak; and hear, O earth, the
word of my mouth.

32:2 My doctrin shall drop as the rain, my speech shall distil as the
dew, as the small rain upon the tender herb, and as the shower upon
th grass: 32:3 becaus I will publish the name of the lord: ascribe
y great unto our god.

32:4 He is the rock, hi work is perfect: for all hi way are
judgment: a god of truth and without iniquity, just and right is he.

32:5 they have corrupt themselves, their spot is not the spot of his
children: they are a pervers and crook generation.

32:6 Do ye thu requit the lord, O foolish peopl and unwise? is not
h thi father that hath bought thee? hath he not made thee, and
establish thee?  32:7 rememb the day of old, consid the years
of mani generations: ask thi father, and he will shew thee; thy
elders, and they will tell thee.

32:8 when the most high divid to the nation their inheritance, when
h separ the son of adam, he set the bound of the people
accord to the number of the children of israel.

32:9 for the lord' portion is hi people; jacob is the lot of his
inheritance.

32:10 He found him in a desert land, and in the wast howling
wilderness; he led him about, he instruct him, he kept him as the
appl of hi eye.

32:11 As an eagl stirreth up her nest, fluttereth over her young,
spreadeth abroad her wings, taketh them, beareth them on her wings:
32:12 So the lord alon did lead him, and there wa no strang god
with him.

32:13 He made him ride on the high place of the earth, that he might
eat the increas of the fields; and he made him to suck honey out of
th rock, and oil out of the flinti rock; 32:14 butter of kine, and
milk of sheep, with fat of lambs, and ram of the breed of bashan, and
goats, with the fat of kidney of wheat; and thou didst drink the pure
blood of the grape.

32:15 but jeshurun wax fat, and kicked: thou art waxen fat, thou art
grown thick, thou art cover with fatness; then he forsook god which
mad him, and lightli esteem the rock of hi salvation.

32:16 they provok him to jealousi with strang gods, with
abomin provok they him to anger.

32:17 they sacrif unto devils, not to god; to god whom they knew
not, to new god that came newli up, whom your father fear not.

32:18 Of the rock that begat thee thou art unmindful, and hast
forgotten god that form thee.

32:19 and when the lord saw it, he abhor them, becaus of the
provok of hi sons, and of hi daughters.

32:20 and he said, I will hide my face from them, I will see what
their end shall be: for they are a veri froward generation, children
in whom is no faith.

32:21 they have move me to jealousi with that which is not god; they
hav provok me to anger with their vanities: and I will move them to
jealousi with those which are not a people; I will provok them to
ang with a foolish nation.

32:22 for a fire is kindl in mine anger, and shall burn unto the
lowest hell, and shall consum the earth with her increase, and set on
fir the foundat of the mountains.

32:23 I will heap mischief upon them; I will spend mine arrow upon
them.

32:24 they shall be burnt with hunger, and devour with burn heat,
and with bitter destruction: I will also send the teeth of beast upon
them, with the poison of serpent of the dust.

32:25 the sword without, and terror within, shall destroy both the
young man and the virgin, the suckl also with the man of gray
hairs.

32:26 I said, I would scatter them into corners, I would make the
remembr of them to ceas from among men: 32:27 were it not that i
fear the wrath of the enemy, lest their adversari should behave
themselv strangely, and lest they should say, our hand is high, and
th lord hath not done all this.

32:28 for they are a nation void of counsel, neither is there any
understand in them.

32:29 O that they were wise, that they understood this, that they
would consid their latter end!  32:30 how should one chase a
thousand, and two put ten thousand to flight, except their rock had
sold them, and the lord had shut them up?  32:31 for their rock is not
a our rock, even our enemi themselv be judges.

32:32 for their vine is of the vine of sodom, and of the field of
gomorrah: their grape are grape of gall, their cluster are bitter:
32:33 their wine is the poison of dragons, and the cruel venom of
asps.

32:34 Is not thi laid up in store with me, and seal up among my
treasures?  32:35 To me belongeth vengeanc and recompence; their foot
shal slide in due time: for the day of their calam is at hand, and
th thing that shall come upon them make haste.

32:36 for the lord shall judg hi people, and repent himself for his
servants, when he seeth that their power is gone, and there is none
shut up, or left.

32:37 and he shall say, where are their gods, their rock in whom they
trusted, 32:38 which did eat the fat of their sacrifices, and drank
th wine of their drink offerings? let them rise up and help you, and
b your protection.

32:39 see now that I, even I, am he, and there is no god with me: i
kill, and I make alive; I wound, and I heal: neither is there ani that
can deliv out of my hand.

32:40 for I lift up my hand to heaven, and say, I live for ever.

32:41 If I whet my glitter sword, and mine hand take hold on
judgment; I will render vengeanc to mine enemies, and will reward
them that hate me.

32:42 I will make mine arrow drunk with blood, and my sword shall
devour flesh; and that with the blood of the slain and of the
captives, from the begin of reveng upon the enemy.

32:43 rejoice, O ye nations, with hi people: for he will aveng the
blood of hi servants, and will render vengeanc to hi adversaries,
and will be merci unto hi land, and to hi people.

32:44 and mose came and spake all the word of thi song in the ears
of the people, he, and hoshea the son of nun.

32:45 and mose made an end of speak all these word to all israel:
32:46 and he said unto them, set your heart unto all the word which
i testifi among you thi day, which ye shall command your children to
observ to do, all the word of thi law.

32:47 for it is not a vain thing for you; becaus it is your life: and
through thi thing ye shall prolong your day in the land, whither ye
go over jordan to possess it.

32:48 and the lord spake unto mose that selfsam day, saying, 32:49
get thee up into thi mountain abarim, unto mount nebo, which is in
th land of moab, that is over against jericho; and behold the land of
canaan, which I give unto the children of israel for a possession:
32:50 and die in the mount whither thou goest up, and be gather unto
thi people; as aaron thi brother die in mount hor, and wa gathered
unto hi people: 32:51 becaus ye trespass against me among the
children of israel at the water of meribahkadesh, in the wilderness
of zin; becaus ye sanctifi me not in the midst of the children of
israel.

32:52 yet thou shalt see the land befor thee; but thou shalt not go
thith unto the land which I give the children of israel.

33:1 and thi is the blessing, wherewith mose the man of god blessed
th children of israel befor hi death.

33:2 and he said, the lord came from sinai, and rose up from seir unto
them; he shine forth from mount paran, and he came with ten thousands
of saints: from hi right hand went a fieri law for them.

33:3 yea, he love the people; all hi saint are in thi hand: and
they sat down at thi feet; everi one shall receiv of thi words.

33:4 mose command us a law, even the inherit of the
congreg of jacob.

33:5 and he wa king in jeshurun, when the head of the peopl and the
trib of israel were gather together.

33:6 let reuben live, and not die; and let not hi men be few.

33:7 and thi is the bless of judah: and he said, hear, lord, the
voic of judah, and bring him unto hi people: let hi hand be
suffici for him; and be thou an help to him from hi enemies.

33:8 and of levi he said, let thi thummim and thi urim be with thy
holi one, whom thou didst prove at massah, and with whom thou didst
striv at the water of meribah; 33:9 who said unto hi father and to
hi mother, I have not seen him; neither did he acknowledg his
brethren, nor knew hi own children: for they have observ thi word,
and kept thi covenant.

33:10 they shall teach jacob thi judgments, and israel thi law: they
shal put incens befor thee, and whole burnt sacrific upon thine
altar.

33:11 bless, lord, hi substance, and accept the work of hi hands;
smit through the loin of them that rise against him, and of them
that hate him, that they rise not again.

33:12 and of benjamin he said, the belov of the lord shall dwell in
safeti by him; and the lord shall cover him all the day long, and he
shal dwell between hi shoulders.

33:13 and of joseph he said, bless of the lord be hi land, for the
preci thing of heaven, for the dew, and for the deep that coucheth
beneath, 33:14 and for the preciou fruit brought forth by the sun,
and for the preciou thing put forth by the moon, 33:15 and for the
chief thing of the ancient mountains, and for the preciou thing of
th last hills, 33:16 and for the preciou thing of the earth and
 thereof, and for the good will of him that dwelt in the bush:
let the bless come upon the head of joseph, and upon the top of the
head of him that wa separ from hi brethren.

33:17 hi glori is like the firstl of hi bullock, and hi horns
ar like the horn of unicorns: with them he shall push the people
togeth to the end of the earth: and they are the ten thousand of
ephraim, and they are the thousand of manasseh.

33:18 and of zebulun he said, rejoice, zebulun, in thi go out; and,
issachar, in thi tents.

33:19 they shall call the peopl unto the mountain; there they shall
off sacrific of righteousness: for they shall suck of the
abund of the seas, and of treasur hid in the sand.

33:20 and of gad he said, bless be he that enlargeth gad: he
dwelleth as a lion, and teareth the arm with the crown of the head.

33:21 and he provid the first part for himself, becaus there, in a
port of the lawgiver, wa he seated; and he came with the head of
th people, he execut the justic of the lord, and hi judgments
with israel.

33:22 and of dan he said, dan is a lion' whelp: he shall leap from
bashan.

33:23 and of naphtali he said, O naphtali, satisfi with favour, and
ful with the bless of the lord: possess thou the west and the
south.

33:24 and of asher he said, let asher be bless with children; let
him be accept to hi brethren, and let him dip hi foot in oil.

33:25 thi shoe shall be iron and brass; and as thi days, so shall thy
strength be.

33:26 there is none like unto the god of jeshurun, who rideth upon the
heaven in thi help, and in hi excel on the sky.

33:27 the etern god is thi refuge, and underneath are the
everlast arms: and he shall thrust out the enemi from befor thee;
and shall say, destroy them.

33:28 israel then shall dwell in safeti alone: the fountain of jacob
shal be upon a land of corn and wine; also hi heaven shall drop
down dew.

33:29 happi art thou, O israel: who is like unto thee, O peopl saved
bi the lord, the shield of thi help, and who is the sword of thy
excellency! and thine enemi shall be found liar unto thee; and thou
shalt tread upon their high places.

34:1 and mose went up from the plain of moab unto the mountain of
nebo, to the top of pisgah, that is over against jericho. and the lord
shew him all the land of gilead, unto dan, 34:2 and all naphtali,
and the land of ephraim, and manasseh, and all the land of judah, unto
th utmost sea, 34:3 and the south, and the plain of the valley of
jericho, the citi of palm trees, unto zoar.

34:4 and the lord said unto him, thi is the land which I sware unto
abraham, unto isaac, and unto jacob, saying, I will give it unto thy
seed: I have caus thee to see it with thine eyes, but thou shalt not
go over thither.

34:5 So mose the servant of the lord die there in the land of moab,
accord to the word of the lord.

34:6 and he buri him in a valley in the land of moab, over against
bethpeor: but no man knoweth of hi sepulchr unto thi day.

34:7 and mose wa an hundr and twenti year old when he died: his
ey wa not dim, nor hi natur forc abated.

34:8 and the children of israel wept for mose in the plain of moab
thirti days: so the day of weep and mourn for mose were ended.

34:9 and joshua the son of nun wa full of the spirit of wisdom; for
mos had laid hi hand upon him: and the children of israel
hearken unto him, and did as the lord command moses.

34:10 and there aros not a prophet sinc in israel like unto moses,
whom the lord knew face to face, 34:11 In all the sign and the
wonders, which the lord sent him to do in the land of egypt to
pharaoh, and to all hi servants, and to all hi land, 34:12 and in
al that mighti hand, and in all the great terror which mose shewed
in the sight of all israel.




th book of joshua


1:1 now after the death of mose the servant of the lord it came to
pass, that the lord spake unto joshua the son of nun, moses' minister,
saying, 1:2 mose my servant is dead; now therefor arise, go over
thi jordan, thou, and all thi people, unto the land which I do give
to them, even to the children of israel.

1:3 everi place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon, that have
i given unto you, as I said unto moses.

1:4 from the wilder and thi lebanon even unto the great river,
th river euphrates, all the land of the hittites, and unto the great
sea toward the go down of the sun, shall be your coast.

1:5 there shall not ani man be abl to stand befor thee all the days
of thi life: as I wa with moses, so I will be with thee: I will not
fail thee, nor forsak thee.

1:6 Be strong and of a good courage: for unto thi peopl shalt thou
divid for an inherit the land, which I sware unto their fathers
to give them.

1:7 onli be thou strong and veri courageous, that thou mayest observe
to do accord to all the law, which mose my servant command thee:
turn not from it to the right hand or to the left, that thou mayest
prosp withersoev thou goest.

1:8 thi book of the law shall not depart out of thi mouth; but thou
shalt medit therein day and night, that thou mayest observ to do
accord to all that is written therein: for then thou shalt make thy
way prosperous, and then thou shalt have good success.

1:9 have not I command thee? Be strong and of a good courage; be not
afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the lord thi god is with thee
whithersoev thou goest.

1:10 then joshua command the offic of the people, saying, 1:11
pass through the host, and command the people, saying, prepar you
victuals; for within three day ye shall pass over thi jordan, to go
in to possess the land, which the lord your god giveth you to possess
it.

1:12 and to the reubenites, and to the gadites, and to half the tribe
of manasseh, spake joshua, saying, 1:13 rememb the word which moses
th servant of the lord command you, saying, the lord your god hath
given you rest, and hath given you thi land.

1:14 your wives, your littl ones, and your cattle, shall remain in
th land which mose gave you on thi side jordan; but ye shall pass
befor your brethren armed, all the mighti men of valour, and help
them; 1:15 until the lord have given your brethren rest, as he hath
given you, and they also have possess the land which the lord your
god giveth them: then ye shall return unto the land of your
possession, and enjoy it, which mose the lord' servant gave you on
thi side jordan toward the sunrising.

1:16 and they answer joshua, saying, all that thou commandest us we
wil do, and whithersoev thou sendest us, we will go.

1:17 accord as we hearken unto mose in all things, so will we
hearken unto thee: onli the lord thi god be with thee, as he wa with
moses.

1:18 whosoev he be that doth rebel against thi commandment, and will
not hearken unto thi word in all that thou commandest him, he shall
b put to death: onli be strong and of a good courage.

2:1 and joshua the son of nun sent out of shittim two men to spy
secretly, saying, Go view the land, even jericho. and they went, and
cam into an harlot' house, name rahab, and lodg there.

2:2 and it wa told the king of jericho, saying, behold, there came
men in hither to night of the children of israel to search out the
country.

2:3 and the king of jericho sent unto rahab, saying, bring forth the
men that are come to thee, which are enter into thine house: for
they be come to search out all the country.

2:4 and the woman took the two men, and hid them, and said thus, there
cam men unto me, but I wist not whenc they were: 2:5 and it came to
pass about the time of shut of the gate, when it wa dark, that
th men went out: whither the men went I wot not: pursu after them
quickly; for ye shall overtak them.

2:6 but she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them
with the stalk of flax, which she had laid in order upon the roof.

2:7 and the men pursu after them the way to jordan unto the fords:
and as soon as they which pursu after them were gone out, they shut
th gate.

2:8 and befor they were laid down, she came up unto them upon the
roof; 2:9 and she said unto the men, I know that the lord hath given
y the land, and that your terror is fallen upon us, and that all the
inhabit of the land faint becaus of you.

2:10 for we have heard how the lord dri up the water of the red sea
for you, when ye came out of egypt; and what ye did unto the two kings
of the amorites, that were on the other side jordan, sihon and og,
whom ye utterli destroyed.

2:11 and as soon as we had heard these things, our heart did melt,
neith did there remain ani more courag in ani man, becaus of you:
for the lord your god, he is god in heaven above, and in earth
beneath.

2:12 now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the lord, sinc i
hav shew you kindness, that ye will also shew kind unto my
father' house, and give me a true token: 2:13 and that ye will save
al my father, and my mother, and my brethren, and my sisters, and
al that they have, and deliv our live from death.

2:14 and the men answer her, our life for yours, if ye utter not
thi our business. and it shall be, when the lord hath given us the
land, that we will deal kindli and truli with thee.

2:15 then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her
hous wa upon the town wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.

2:16 and she said unto them, get you to the mountain, lest the
pursu meet you; and hide yourselv there three days, until the
pursu be returned: and afterward may ye go your way.

2:17 and the men said unto her, We will be blameless of thi thine
oath which thou hast made us swear.

2:18 behold, when we come into the land, thou shalt bind thi line of
scarlet thread in the window which thou didst let us down by: and thou
shalt bring thi father, and thi mother, and thi brethren, and all thy
father' household, home unto thee.

2:19 and it shall be, that whosoev shall go out of the door of thy
hous into the street, hi blood shall be upon hi head, and we will
b guiltless: and whosoev shall be with thee in the house, hi blood
shal be on our head, if ani hand be upon him.

2:20 and if thou utter thi our business, then we will be quit of
thin oath which thou hast made us to swear.

2:21 and she said, accord unto your words, so be it. and she sent
them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the
window.

2:22 and they went, and came unto the mountain, and abod there three
days, until the pursuer were returned: and the pursuer sought them
throughout all the way, but found them not.

2:23 So the two men returned, and descend from the mountain, and
pass over, and came to joshua the son of nun, and told him all
th that befel them: 2:24 and they said unto joshua, truli the
lord hath deliv into our hand all the land; for even all the
inhabit of the countri do faint becaus of us.

3:1 and joshua rose earli in the morning; and they remov from
shittim, and came to jordan, he and all the children of israel, and
lodg there befor they pass over.

3:2 and it came to pass after three days, that the offic went
through the host; 3:3 and they command the people, saying, when ye
se the ark of the coven of the lord your god, and the priest the
levit bear it, then ye shall remov from your place, and go after
it.

3:4 yet there shall be a space between you and it, about two thousand
cubit by measure: come not near unto it, that ye may know the way by
which ye must go: for ye have not pass thi way heretofore.

3:5 and joshua said unto the people, sanctifi yourselves: for to
morrow the lord will do wonder among you.

3:6 and joshua spake unto the priests, saying, take up the ark of the
covenant, and pass over befor the people. and they took up the ark of
th covenant, and went befor the people.

3:7 and the lord said unto joshua, thi day will I begin to magnify
the in the sight of all israel, that they may know that, as I was
with moses, so I will be with thee.

3:8 and thou shalt command the priest that bear the ark of the
covenant, saying, when ye are come to the brink of the water of
jordan, ye shall stand still in jordan.

3:9 and joshua said unto the children of israel, come hither, and hear
th word of the lord your god.

3:10 and joshua said, herebi ye shall know that the live god is
among you, and that he will without fail drive out from befor you the
canaanites, and the hittites, and the hivites, and the perizzites, and
th girgashites, and the amorites, and the jebusites.

3:11 behold, the ark of the coven of the lord of all the earth
passeth over befor you into jordan.

3:12 now therefor take you twelv men out of the tribe of israel,
out of everi tribe a man.

3:13 and it shall come to pass, as soon as the sole of the feet of
th priest that bear the ark of the lord, the lord of all the earth,
shal rest in the water of jordan, that the water of jordan shall be
cut off from the water that come down from above; and they shall
stand upon an heap.

3:14 and it came to pass, when the peopl remov from their tents, to
pass over jordan, and the priest bear the ark of the covenant
befor the people; 3:15 and as they that bare the ark were come unto
jordan, and the feet of the priest that bare the ark were dip in
th brim of the water, (for jordan overfloweth all hi bank all the
tim of harvest,) 3:16 that the water which came down from above
stood and rose up upon an heap veri far from the citi adam, that is
besid zaretan: and those that came down toward the sea of the plain,
even the salt sea, failed, and were cut off: and the peopl passed
ov right against jericho.

3:17 and the priest that bare the ark of the coven of the lord
stood firm on dri ground in the midst of jordan, and all the
israelit pass over on dri ground, until all the peopl were passed
clean over jordan.

4:1 and it came to pass, when all the peopl were clean pass over
jordan, that the lord spake unto joshua, saying, 4:2 take you twelve
men out of the people, out of everi tribe a man, 4:3 and command ye
them, saying, take you henc out of the midst of jordan, out of the
plac where the priests' feet stood firm, twelv stones, and ye shall
carri them over with you, and leav them in the lodg place, where
y shall lodg thi night.

4:4 then joshua call the twelv men, whom he had prepar of the
children of israel, out of everi tribe a man: 4:5 and joshua said unto
them, pass over befor the ark of the lord your god into the midst of
jordan, and take you up everi man of you a stone upon hi shoulder,
accord unto the number of the tribe of the children of israel: 4:6
that thi may be a sign among you, that when your children ask their
fath in time to come, saying, what mean ye by these stones?  4:7
then ye shall answer them, that the water of jordan were cut off
befor the ark of the coven of the lord; when it pass over
jordan, the water of jordan were cut off: and these stone shall be
for a memori unto the children of israel for ever.

4:8 and the children of israel did so as joshua commanded, and took up
twelv stone out of the midst of jordan, as the lord spake unto
joshua, accord to the number of the tribe of the children of
israel, and carri them over with them unto the place where they
lodged, and laid them down there.

4:9 and joshua set up twelv stone in the midst of jordan, in the
plac where the feet of the priest which bare the ark of the covenant
stood: and they are there unto thi day.

4:10 for the priest which bare the ark stood in the midst of jordan,
until everyth wa finish that the lord command joshua to speak
unto the people, accord to all that mose command joshua: and the
peopl hast and pass over.

4:11 and it came to pass, when all the peopl were clean pass over,
that the ark of the lord pass over, and the priests, in the presence
of the people.

4:12 and the children of reuben, and the children of gad, and half the
trib of manasseh, pass over arm befor the children of israel, as
mos spake unto them: 4:13 about forti thousand prepar for war
pass over befor the lord unto battle, to the plain of jericho.

4:14 On that day the lord magnifi joshua in the sight of all israel;
and they fear him, as they fear moses, all the day of hi life.

4:15 and the lord spake unto joshua, saying, 4:16 command the priests
that bear the ark of the testimony, that they come up out of jordan.

4:17 joshua therefor command the priests, saying, come ye up out of
jordan.

4:18 and it came to pass, when the priest that bare the ark of the
coven of the lord were come up out of the midst of jordan, and the
sol of the priests' feet were lift up unto the dri land, that the
wat of jordan return unto their place, and flow over all his
banks, as they did before.

4:19 and the peopl came up out of jordan on the tenth day of the
first month, and encamp in gilgal, in the east border of jericho.

4:20 and those twelv stones, which they took out of jordan, did
joshua pitch in gilgal.

4:21 and he spake unto the children of israel, saying, when your
children shall ask their father in time to come, saying, what mean
thes stones?  4:22 then ye shall let your children know, saying,
israel came over thi jordan on dri land.

4:23 for the lord your god dri up the water of jordan from before
you, until ye were pass over, as the lord your god did to the red
sea, which he dri up from befor us, until we were gone over: 4:24
that all the peopl of the earth might know the hand of the lord, that
it is mighty: that ye might fear the lord your god for ever.

5:1 and it came to pass, when all the king of the amorites, which
wer on the side of jordan westward, and all the king of the
canaanites, which were by the sea, heard that the lord had dri up
th water of jordan from befor the children of israel, until we were
pass over, that their heart melted, neither wa there spirit in them
ani more, becaus of the children of israel.

5:2 At that time the lord said unto joshua, make thee sharp knives,
and circumcis again the children of israel the second time.

5:3 and joshua made him sharp knives, and circumcis the children of
israel at the hill of the foreskins.

5:4 and thi is the caus whi joshua did circumcise: all the people
that came out of egypt, that were males, even all the men of war, died
in the wilder by the way, after they came out of egypt.

5:5 now all the peopl that came out were circumcised: but all the
peopl that were born in the wilder by the way as they came forth
out of egypt, them they had not circumcised.

5:6 for the children of israel walk forti year in the wilderness,
til all the peopl that were men of war, which came out of egypt,
wer consumed, becaus they obey not the voic of the lord: unto
whom the lord sware that he would not shew them the land, which the
lord sware unto their father that he would give us, a land that
floweth with milk and honey.

5:7 and their children, whom he rais up in their stead, them joshua
circumcised: for they were uncircumcised, becaus they had not
circumcis them by the way.

5:8 and it came to pass, when they had done circumcis all the
people, that they abod in their place in the camp, till they were
whole.

5:9 and the lord said unto joshua, thi day have I roll away the
reproach of egypt from off you. wherefor the name of the place is
cal gilgal unto thi day.

5:10 and the children of israel encamp in gilgal, and kept the
passov on the fourteenth day of the month at even in the plain of
jericho.

5:11 and they did eat of the old corn of the land on the morrow after
th passover, unleaven cakes, and parch corn in the selfsam day.

5:12 and the manna ceas on the morrow after they had eaten of the
old corn of the land; neither had the children of israel manna any
more; but they did eat of the fruit of the land of canaan that year.

5:13 and it came to pass, when joshua wa by jericho, that he lifted
up hi eye and looked, and, behold, there stood a man over against
him with hi sword drawn in hi hand: and joshua went unto him, and
said unto him, art thou for us, or for our adversaries?  5:14 and he
said, nay; but as captain of the host of the lord am I now come. and
joshua fell on hi face to the earth, and did worship, and said unto
him, what saith my lord unto hi servant?  5:15 and the captain of the
lord' host said unto joshua, loos thi shoe from off thi foot; for
th place whereon thou standest is holy. and joshua did so.

6:1 now jericho wa straitli shut up becaus of the children of
israel: none went out, and none came in.

6:2 and the lord said unto joshua, see, I have given into thine hand
jericho, and the king thereof, and the mighti men of valour.

6:3 and ye shall compass the city, all ye men of war, and go round
about the citi once. thu shalt thou do six days.

6:4 and seven priest shall bear befor the ark seven trumpet of
rams' horns: and the seventh day ye shall compass the citi seven
times, and the priest shall blow with the trumpets.

6:5 and it shall come to pass, that when they make a long blast with
th ram' horn, and when ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the
peopl shall shout with a great shout; and the wall of the citi shall
fal down flat, and the peopl shall ascend up everi man straight
befor him.

6:6 and joshua the son of nun call the priests, and said unto them,
tak up the ark of the covenant, and let seven priest bear seven
trumpet of rams' horn befor the ark of the lord.

6:7 and he said unto the people, pass on, and compass the city, and
let him that is arm pass on befor the ark of the lord.

6:8 and it came to pass, when joshua had spoken unto the people, that
th seven priest bear the seven trumpet of rams' horn pass on
befor the lord, and blew with the trumpets: and the ark of the
coven of the lord follow them.

6:9 and the arm men went befor the priest that blew with the
trumpets, and the rereward came after the ark, the priest go on,
and blow with the trumpets.

6:10 and joshua had command the people, saying, Ye shall not shout,
nor make ani nois with your voice, neither shall ani word proceed out
of your mouth, until the day I bid you shout; then shall ye shout.

6:11 So the ark of the lord compass the city, go about it once:
and they came into the camp, and lodg in the camp.

6:12 and joshua rose earli in the morning, and the priest took up the
ark of the lord.

6:13 and seven priest bear seven trumpet of rams' horn before
th ark of the lord went on continually, and blew with the trumpets:
and the arm men went befor them; but the rereward came after the
ark of the lord, the priest go on, and blow with the trumpets.

6:14 and the second day they compass the citi once, and returned
into the camp: so they did six days.

6:15 and it came to pass on the seventh day, that they rose early
about the dawn of the day, and compass the citi after the same
mann seven times: onli on that day they compass the citi seven
times.

6:16 and it came to pass at the seventh time, when the priest blew
with the trumpets, joshua said unto the people, shout; for the lord
hath given you the city.

6:17 and the citi shall be accursed, even it, and all that are
therein, to the lord: onli rahab the harlot shall live, she and all
that are with her in the house, becaus she hid the messeng that we
sent.

6:18 and ye, in ani wise keep yourselv from the accurs thing, lest
y make yourselv accursed, when ye take of the accurs thing, and
mak the camp of israel a curse, and troubl it.

6:19 but all the silver, and gold, and vessel of brass and iron, are
consecr unto the lord: they shall come into the treasuri of the
lord.

6:20 So the peopl shout when the priest blew with the trumpets:
and it came to pass, when the peopl heard the sound of the trumpet,
and the peopl shout with a great shout, that the wall fell down
flat, so that the peopl went up into the city, everi man straight
befor him, and they took the city.

6:21 and they utterli destroy all that wa in the city, both man and
woman, young and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass, with the edg of the
sword.

6:22 but joshua had said unto the two men that had spi out the
country, Go into the harlot' house, and bring out thenc the woman,
and all that she hath, as ye sware unto her.

6:23 and the young men that were spi went in, and brought out rahab,
and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she
had; and they brought out all her kindred, and left them without the
camp of israel.

6:24 and they burnt the citi with fire, and all that wa therein: only
th silver, and the gold, and the vessel of brass and of iron, they
put into the treasuri of the hous of the lord.

6:25 and joshua save rahab the harlot alive, and her father's
household, and all that she had; and she dwelleth in israel even unto
thi day; becaus she hid the messengers, which joshua sent to spi out
jericho.

6:26 and joshua adjur them at that time, saying, curs be the man
befor the lord, that riseth up and buildeth thi citi jericho: he
shal lay the foundat thereof in hi firstborn, and in hi youngest
son shall he set up the gate of it.

6:27 So the lord wa with joshua; and hi fame wa nois throughout
al the country.

7:1 but the children of israel commit a trespass in the accursed
thing: for achan, the son of carmi, the son of zabdi, the son of
zerah, of the tribe of judah, took of the accurs thing: and the
ang of the lord wa kindl against the children of israel.

7:2 and joshua sent men from jericho to ai, which is besid bethaven,
on the east of bethel, and spake unto them, saying, Go up and view the
country.

and the men went up and view ai.

7:3 and they return to joshua, and said unto him, let not all the
peopl go up; but let about two or three thousand men go up and smite
ai; and make not all the peopl to labour thither; for they are but
few.

7:4 So there went up thither of the peopl about three thousand men:
and they fled befor the men of ai.

7:5 and the men of Ai smote of them about thirti and six men: for they
chas them from befor the gate even unto shebarim, and smote them in
th go down: wherefor the heart of the peopl melted, and became
a water.

7:6 and joshua rent hi clothes, and fell to the earth upon hi face
befor the ark of the lord until the eventide, he and the elder of
israel, and put dust upon their heads.

7:7 and joshua said, alas, O lord god, wherefor hast thou at all
brought thi peopl over jordan, to deliv us into the hand of the
amorites, to destroy us? would to god we had been content, and dwelt
on the other side jordan!  7:8 O lord, what shall I say, when israel
turneth their back befor their enemies!  7:9 for the canaanit and
al the inhabit of the land shall hear of it, and shall environ us
round, and cut off our name from the earth: and what wilt thou do unto
thi great name?  7:10 and the lord said unto joshua, get thee up;
wherefor liest thou thu upon thi face?  7:11 israel hath sinned, and
they have also transgress my coven which I command them: for
they have even taken of the accurs thing, and have also stolen, and
dissembl also, and they have put it even among their own stuff.

7:12 therefor the children of israel could not stand befor their
enemies, but turn their back befor their enemies, becaus they
wer accursed: neither will I be with you ani more, except ye destroy
th accurs from among you.

7:13 up, sanctifi the people, and say, sanctifi yourselv against to
morrow: for thu saith the lord god of israel, there is an accursed
th in the midst of thee, O israel: thou canst not stand before
thin enemies, until ye take away the accurs thing from among you.

7:14 In the morn therefor ye shall be brought accord to your
tribes: and it shall be, that the tribe which the lord taketh shall
com accord to the famili thereof; and the famili which the lord
shal take shall come by households; and the household which the lord
shal take shall come man by man.

7:15 and it shall be, that he that is taken with the accurs thing
shal be burnt with fire, he and all that he hath: becaus he hath
transgress the coven of the lord, and becaus he hath wrought
folli in israel.

7:16 So joshua rose up earli in the morning, and brought israel by
their tribes; and the tribe of judah wa taken: 7:17 and he brought
th famili of judah; and he took the famili of the zarhites: and he
brought the famili of the zarhit man by man; and zabdi wa taken:
7:18 and he brought hi household man by man; and achan, the son of
carmi, the son of zabdi, the son of zerah, of the tribe of judah, was
taken.

7:19 and joshua said unto achan, My son, give, I pray thee, glori to
th lord god of israel, and make confess unto him; and tell me now
what thou hast done; hide it not from me.

7:20 and achan answer joshua, and said, inde I have sin against
th lord god of israel, and thu and thu have I done: 7:21 when I saw
among the spoil a goodli babylonish garment, and two hundr shekels
of silver, and a wedg of gold of fifti shekel weight, then I coveted
them, and took them; and, behold, they are hid in the earth in the
midst of my tent, and the silver under it.

7:22 So joshua sent messengers, and they ran unto the tent; and,
behold, it wa hid in hi tent, and the silver under it.

7:23 and they took them out of the midst of the tent, and brought them
unto joshua, and unto all the children of israel, and laid them out
befor the lord.

7:24 and joshua, and all israel with him, took achan the son of zerah,
and the silver, and the garment, and the wedg of gold, and hi sons,
and hi daughters, and hi oxen, and hi asses, and hi sheep, and his
tent, and all that he had: and they brought them unto the valley of
achor.

7:25 and joshua said, whi hast thou troubl us? the lord shall
troubl thee thi day. and all israel stone him with stones, and
burn them with fire, after they had stone them with stones.

7:26 and they rais over him a great heap of stone unto thi day. so
th lord turn from the fierc of hi anger. wherefor the name
of that place wa called, the valley of achor, unto thi day.

8:1 and the lord said unto joshua, fear not, neither be thou dismayed:
tak all the peopl of war with thee, and arise, go up to ai: see, i
hav given into thi hand the king of ai, and hi people, and hi city,
and hi land: 8:2 and thou shalt do to Ai and her king as thou didst
unto jericho and her king: onli the spoil thereof, and the cattle
thereof, shall ye take for a prey unto yourselves: lay thee an ambush
for the citi behind it.

8:3 So joshua arose, and all the peopl of war, to go up against ai:
and joshua chose out thirti thousand mighti men of valour, and sent
them away by night.

8:4 and he command them, saying, behold, ye shall lie in wait
against the city, even behind the city: go not veri far from the city,
but be ye all ready: 8:5 and I, and all the peopl that are with me,
wil approach unto the city: and it shall come to pass, when they come
out against us, as at the first, that we will flee befor them, 8:6
(for they will come out after us) till we have drawn them from the
city; for they will say, they flee befor us, as at the first:
therefor we will flee befor them.

8:7 then ye shall rise up from the ambush, and seiz upon the city:
for the lord your god will deliv it into your hand.

8:8 and it shall be, when ye have taken the city, that ye shall set
th citi on fire: accord to the command of the lord shall ye
do. see, I have command you.

8:9 joshua therefor sent them forth: and they went to lie in ambush,
and abod between bethel and ai, on the west side of ai: but joshua
lodg that night among the people.

8:10 and joshua rose up earli in the morning, and number the people,
and went up, he and the elder of israel, befor the peopl to ai.

8:11 and all the people, even the peopl of war that were with him,
went up, and drew nigh, and came befor the city, and pitch on the
north side of ai: now there wa a valley between them and ai.

8:12 and he took about five thousand men, and set them to lie in
ambush between bethel and ai, on the west side of the city.

8:13 and when they had set the people, even all the host that wa on
th north of the city, and their lier in wait on the west of the
city, joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.

8:14 and it came to pass, when the king of Ai saw it, that they hasted
and rose up early, and the men of the citi went out against israel to
battle, he and all hi people, at a time appointed, befor the plain;
but he wist not that there were lier in ambush against him behind the
city.

8:15 and joshua and all israel made as if they were beaten before
them, and fled by the way of the wilderness.

8:16 and all the peopl that were in Ai were call togeth to pursue
aft them: and they pursu after joshua, and were drawn away from
th city.

8:17 and there wa not a man left in Ai or bethel, that went not out
aft israel: and they left the citi open, and pursu after israel.

8:18 and the lord said unto joshua, stretch out the spear that is in
thi hand toward ai; for I will give it into thine hand. and joshua
stretch out the spear that he had in hi hand toward the city.

8:19 and the ambush aros quickli out of their place, and they ran as
soon as he had stretch out hi hand: and they enter into the city,
and took it, and hast and set the citi on fire.

8:20 and when the men of Ai look behind them, they saw, and, behold,
th smoke of the citi ascend up to heaven, and they had no power to
fle thi way or that way: and the peopl that fled to the wilderness
turn back upon the pursuers.

8:21 and when joshua and all israel saw that the ambush had taken the
city, and that the smoke of the citi ascended, then they turn again,
and slew the men of ai.

8:22 and the other issu out of the citi against them; so they were
in the midst of israel, some on thi side, and some on that side: and
they smote them, so that they let none of them remain or escape.

8:23 and the king of Ai they took alive, and brought him to joshua.

8:24 and it came to pass, when israel had made an end of slay all
th inhabit of Ai in the field, in the wilder wherein they
chas them, and when they were all fallen on the edg of the sword,
until they were consumed, that all the israelit return unto ai,
and smote it with the edg of the sword.

8:25 and so it was, that all that fell that day, both of men and
women, were twelv thousand, even all the men of ai.

8:26 for joshua drew not hi hand back, wherewith he stretch out the
spear, until he had utterli destroy all the inhabit of ai.

8:27 onli the cattl and the spoil of that citi israel took for a prey
unto themselves, accord unto the word of the lord which he
command joshua.

8:28 and joshua burnt ai, and made it an heap for ever, even a
desol unto thi day.

8:29 and the king of Ai he hang on a tree until eventide: and as
soon as the sun wa down, joshua command that they should take his
carcas down from the tree, and cast it at the enter of the gate of
th city, and rais thereon a great heap of stones, that remaineth
unto thi day.

8:30 then joshua built an altar unto the lord god of israel in mount
ebal, 8:31 As mose the servant of the lord command the children of
israel, as it is written in the book of the law of moses, an altar of
whol stones, over which no man hath lift up ani iron: and they
off thereon burnt offer unto the lord, and sacrif peace
offerings.

8:32 and he wrote there upon the stone a copi of the law of moses,
which he wrote in the presenc of the children of israel.

8:33 and all israel, and their elders, and officers, and their judges,
stood on thi side the ark and on that side befor the priest the
levites, which bare the ark of the coven of the lord, as well the
stranger, as he that wa born among them; half of them over against
mount gerizim, and half of them over against mount ebal; as mose the
serv of the lord had command before, that they should bless the
peopl of israel.

8:34 and afterward he read all the word of the law, the bless and
cursings, accord to all that is written in the book of the law.

8:35 there wa not a word of all that mose commanded, which joshua
read not befor all the congreg of israel, with the women, and
th littl ones, and the stranger that were convers among them.

9:1 and it came to pass, when all the king which were on thi side
jordan, in the hills, and in the valleys, and in all the coast of the
great sea over against lebanon, the hittite, and the amorite, the
canaanite, the perizzite, the hivite, and the jebusite, heard thereof;
9:2 that they gather themselv together, to fight with joshua and
with israel, with one accord.

9:3 and when the inhabit of gibeon heard what joshua had done unto
jericho and to ai, 9:4 they did work wilily, and went and made as if
they had been ambassadors, and took old sack upon their asses, and
win bottles, old, and rent, and bound up; 9:5 and old shoe and
clout upon their feet, and old garment upon them; and all the bread
of their provis wa dri and mouldy.

9:6 and they went to joshua unto the camp at gilgal, and said unto
him, and to the men of israel, We be come from a far country: now
therefor make ye a leagu with us.

9:7 and the men of israel said unto the hivites, peradventur ye dwell
among us; and how shall we make a leagu with you?  9:8 and they said
unto joshua, We are thi servants. and joshua said unto them, who are
ye? and from whenc come ye?  9:9 and they said unto him, from a very
far countri thi servant are come becaus of the name of the lord thy
god: for we have heard the fame of him, and all that he did in egypt,
9:10 and all that he did to the two king of the amorites, that were
beyond jordan, to sihon king of heshbon, and to Og king of bashan,
which wa at ashtaroth.

9:11 wherefor our elder and all the inhabit of our countri spake
to us, saying, take victual with you for the journey, and go to meet
them, and say unto them, We are your servants: therefor now make ye a
leagu with us.

9:12 thi our bread we took hot for our provis out of our hous on
th day we came forth to go unto you; but now, behold, it is dry, and
it is mouldy: 9:13 and these bottl of wine, which we filled, were
new; and, behold, they be rent: and these our garment and our shoes
ar becom old by reason of the veri long journey.

9:14 and the men took of their victuals, and ask not counsel at the
mouth of the lord.

9:15 and joshua made peac with them, and made a leagu with them, to
let them live: and the princ of the congreg sware unto them.

9:16 and it came to pass at the end of three day after they had made
a leagu with them, that they heard that they were their neighbours,
and that they dwelt among them.

9:17 and the children of israel journeyed, and came unto their cities
on the third day. now their citi were gibeon, and chephirah, and
beeroth, and kirjathjearim.

9:18 and the children of israel smote them not, becaus the princ of
th congreg had sworn unto them by the lord god of israel. and
al the congreg murmur against the princes.

9:19 but all the princ said unto all the congregation, We have sworn
unto them by the lord god of israel: now therefor we may not touch
them.

9:20 thi we will do to them; we will even let them live, lest wrath
b upon us, becaus of the oath which we sware unto them.

9:21 and the princ said unto them, let them live; but let them be
hew of wood and drawer of water unto all the congregation; as the
princ had promis them.

9:22 and joshua call for them, and he spake unto them, saying,
wherefor have ye beguil us, saying, We are veri far from you; when
y dwell among us?  9:23 now therefor ye are cursed, and there shall
non of you be freed from be bondmen, and hewer of wood and
draw of water for the hous of my god.

9:24 and they answer joshua, and said, becaus it wa certainli told
thi servants, how that the lord thi god command hi servant mose to
giv you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabit of the land
from befor you, therefor we were sore afraid of our live becaus of
you, and have done thi thing.

9:25 and now, behold, we are in thine hand: as it seemeth good and
right unto thee to do unto us, do.

9:26 and so did he unto them, and deliv them out of the hand of
th children of israel, that they slew them not.

9:27 and joshua made them that day hewer of wood and drawer of water
for the congregation, and for the altar of the lord, even unto this
day, in the place which he should choose.

10:1 now it came to pass, when adonizedec king of jerusalem had heard
how joshua had taken ai, and had utterli destroy it; as he had done
to jericho and her king, so he had done to Ai and her king; and how
th inhabit of gibeon had made peac with israel, and were among
them; 10:2 that they fear greatly, becaus gibeon wa a great city,
a one of the royal cities, and becaus it wa greater than ai, and
al the men thereof were mighty.

10:3 wherefor adonizedec king of jerusalem, sent unto hoham king of
hebron, and unto piram king of jarmuth, and unto japhia king of
lachish, and unto debir king of eglon, saying, 10:4 come up unto me,
and help me, that we may smite gibeon: for it hath made peac with
joshua and with the children of israel.

10:5 therefor the five king of the amorites, the king of jerusalem,
th king of hebron, the king of jarmuth, the king of lachish, the king
of eglon, gather themselv together, and went up, they and all
their hosts, and encamp befor gibeon, and made war against it.

10:6 and the men of gibeon sent unto joshua to the camp to gilgal,
saying, slack not thi hand from thi servants; come up to us quickly,
and save us, and help us: for all the king of the amorit that dwell
in the mountain are gather togeth against us.

10:7 So joshua ascend from gilgal, he, and all the peopl of war
with him, and all the mighti men of valour.

10:8 and the lord said unto joshua, fear them not: for I have
deliv them into thine hand; there shall not a man of them stand
befor thee.

10:9 joshua therefor came unto them suddenly, and went up from gilgal
al night.

10:10 and the lord discomfit them befor israel, and slew them with
a great slaughter at gibeon, and chase them along the way that goeth
up to bethhoron, and smote them to azekah, and unto makkedah.

10:11 and it came to pass, as they fled from befor israel, and were
in the go down to bethhoron, that the lord cast down great stones
from heaven upon them unto azekah, and they died: they were more which
di with hailston than they whom the children of israel slew with
th sword.

10:12 then spake joshua to the lord in the day when the lord delivered
up the amorit befor the children of israel, and he said in the
sight of israel, sun, stand thou still upon gibeon; and thou, moon, in
th valley of ajalon.

10:13 and the sun stood still, and the moon stayed, until the people
had aveng themselv upon their enemies. Is not thi written in the
book of jasher? So the sun stood still in the midst of heaven, and
hast not to go down about a whole day.

10:14 and there wa no day like that befor it or after it, that the
lord hearken unto the voic of a man: for the lord fought for
israel.

10:15 and joshua returned, and all israel with him, unto the camp to
gilgal.

10:16 but these five king fled, and hid themselv in a cave at
makkedah.

10:17 and it wa told joshua, saying, the five king are found hid in
a cave at makkedah.

10:18 and joshua said, roll great stone upon the mouth of the cave,
and set men by it for to keep them: 10:19 and stay ye not, but pursue
aft your enemies, and smite the hindmost of them; suffer them not to
ent into their cities: for the lord your god hath deliv them
into your hand.

10:20 and it came to pass, when joshua and the children of israel had
mad an end of slay them with a veri great slaughter, till they
wer consumed, that the rest which remain of them enter into
fenc cities.

10:21 and all the peopl return to the camp to joshua at makkedah in
peace: none move hi tongu against ani of the children of israel.

10:22 then said joshua, open the mouth of the cave, and bring out
thos five king unto me out of the cave.

10:23 and they did so, and brought forth those five king unto him out
of the cave, the king of jerusalem, the king of hebron, the king of
jarmuth, the king of lachish, and the king of eglon.

10:24 and it came to pass, when they brought out those king unto
joshua, that joshua call for all the men of israel, and said unto
th captain of the men of war which went with him, come near, put
your feet upon the neck of these kings. and they came near, and put
their feet upon the neck of them.

10:25 and joshua said unto them, fear not, nor be dismayed, be strong
and of good courage: for thu shall the lord do to all your enemies
against whom ye fight.

10:26 and afterward joshua smote them, and slew them, and hang them
on five trees: and they were hang upon the tree until the evening.

10:27 and it came to pass at the time of the go down of the sun,
that joshua commanded, and they took them down off the trees, and cast
them into the cave wherein they had been hid, and laid great stone in
th cave' mouth, which remain until thi veri day.

10:28 and that day joshua took makkedah, and smote it with the edg of
th sword, and the king thereof he utterli destroyed, them, and all
th soul that were therein; he let none remain: and he did to the
k of makkedah as he did unto the king of jericho.

10:29 then joshua pass from makkedah, and all israel with him, unto
libnah, and fought against libnah: 10:30 and the lord deliv it
also, and the king thereof, into the hand of israel; and he smote it
with the edg of the sword, and all the soul that were therein; he
let none remain in it; but did unto the king thereof as he did unto
th king of jericho.

10:31 and joshua pass from libnah, and all israel with him, unto
lachish, and encamp against it, and fought against it: 10:32 and the
lord deliv lachish into the hand of israel, which took it on the
second day, and smote it with the edg of the sword, and all the souls
that were therein, accord to all that he had done to libnah.

10:33 then horam king of gezer came up to help lachish; and joshua
smot him and hi people, until he had left him none remaining.

10:34 and from lachish joshua pass unto eglon, and all israel with
him; and they encamp against it, and fought against it: 10:35 and
they took it on that day, and smote it with the edg of the sword, and
al the soul that were therein he utterli destroy that day,
accord to all that he had done to lachish.

10:36 and joshua went up from eglon, and all israel with him, unto
hebron; and they fought against it: 10:37 and they took it, and smote
it with the edg of the sword, and the king thereof, and all the
citi thereof, and all the soul that were therein; he left none
remaining, accord to all that he had done to eglon; but destroyed
it utterly, and all the soul that were therein.

10:38 and joshua returned, and all israel with him, to debir; and
fought against it: 10:39 and he took it, and the king thereof, and all
th citi thereof; and they smote them with the edg of the sword,
and utterli destroy all the soul that were therein; he left none
remaining: as he had done to hebron, so he did to debir, and to the
k thereof; as he had done also to libnah, and to her king.

10:40 So joshua smote all the countri of the hills, and of the south,
and of the vale, and of the springs, and all their kings: he left none
remaining, but utterli destroy all that breathed, as the lord god of
israel commanded.

10:41 and joshua smote them from kadeshbarnea even unto gaza, and all
th countri of goshen, even unto gibeon.

10:42 and all these king and their land did joshua take at one time,
becaus the lord god of israel fought for israel.

10:43 and joshua returned, and all israel with him, unto the camp to
gilgal.

11:1 and it came to pass, when jabin king of hazor had heard those
things, that he sent to jobab king of madon, and to the king of
shimron, and to the king of achshaph, 11:2 and to the king that were
on the north of the mountains, and of the plain south of chinneroth,
and in the valley, and in the border of dor on the west, 11:3 and to
th canaanit on the east and on the west, and to the amorite, and the
hittite, and the perizzite, and the jebusit in the mountains, and to
th hivit under hermon in the land of mizpeh.

11:4 and they went out, they and all their host with them, much
people, even as the sand that is upon the sea shore in multitude, with
hors and chariot veri many.

11:5 and when all these king were met together, they came and pitched
togeth at the water of merom, to fight against israel.

11:6 and the lord said unto joshua, Be not afraid becaus of them: for
to morrow about thi time will I deliv them up all slain before
israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariot with
fire.

11:7 So joshua came, and all the peopl of war with him, against them
bi the water of merom suddenly; and they fell upon them.

11:8 and the lord deliv them into the hand of israel, who smote
them, and chase them unto great zidon, and unto misrephothmaim, and
unto the valley of mizpeh eastward; and they smote them, until they
left them none remaining.

11:9 and joshua did unto them as the lord bade him: he hough their
horses, and burnt their chariot with fire.

11:10 and joshua at that time turn back, and took hazor, and smote
th king thereof with the sword: for hazor beforetim wa the head of
al those kingdoms.

11:11 and they smote all the soul that were therein with the edg of
th sword, utterli destroy them: there wa not ani left to breathe:
and he burnt hazor with fire.

11:12 and all the citi of those kings, and all the king of them,
did joshua take, and smote them with the edg of the sword, and he
utterli destroy them, as mose the servant of the lord commanded.

11:13 but as for the citi that stood still in their strength, israel
burn none of them, save hazor only; that did joshua burn.

11:14 and all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, the children
of israel took for a prey unto themselves; but everi man they smote
with the edg of the sword, until they had destroy them, neither
left they ani to breathe.

11:15 As the lord command mose hi servant, so did mose command
joshua, and so did joshua; he left noth undon of all that the lord
command moses.

11:16 So joshua took all that land, the hills, and all the south
country, and all the land of goshen, and the valley, and the plain,
and the mountain of israel, and the valley of the same; 11:17 even
from the mount halak, that goeth up to seir, even unto baalgad in the
valley of lebanon under mount hermon: and all their king he took, and
smot them, and slew them.

11:18 joshua made war a long time with all those kings.

11:19 there wa not a citi that made peac with the children of
israel, save the hivit the inhabit of gibeon: all other they
took in battle.

11:20 for it wa of the lord to harden their hearts, that they should
com against israel in battle, that he might destroy them utterly, and
that they might have no favour, but that he might destroy them, as the
lord command moses.

11:21 and at that time came joshua, and cut off the anakim from the
mountains, from hebron, from debir, from anab, and from all the
mountain of judah, and from all the mountain of israel: joshua
destroy them utterli with their cities.

11:22 there wa none of the anakim left in the land of the children
of israel: onli in gaza, in gath, and in ashdod, there remained.

11:23 So joshua took the whole land, accord to all that the lord
said unto moses; and joshua gave it for an inherit unto israel
accord to their divis by their tribes. and the land rest from
war.

12:1 now these are the king of the land, which the children of israel
smote, and possess their land on the other side jordan toward the
ris of the sun, from the river arnon unto mount hermon, and all the
plain on the east: 12:2 sihon king of the amorites, who dwelt in
heshbon, and rule from aroer, which is upon the bank of the river
arnon, and from the middl of the river, and from half gilead, even
unto the river jabbok, which is the border of the children of ammon;
12:3 and from the plain to the sea of chinneroth on the east, and unto
th sea of the plain, even the salt sea on the east, the way to
bethjeshimoth; and from the south, under ashdothpisgah: 12:4 and the
coast of Og king of bashan, which wa of the remnant of the giants,
that dwelt at ashtaroth and at edrei, 12:5 and reign in mount
hermon, and in salcah, and in all bashan, unto the border of the
geshurit and the maachathites, and half gilead, the border of sihon
k of heshbon.

12:6 them did mose the servant of the lord and the children of israel
smite: and mose the servant of the lord gave it for a possess unto
th reubenites, and the gadites, and the half tribe of manasseh.

12:7 and these are the king of the countri which joshua and the
children of israel smote on thi side jordan on the west, from baalgad
in the valley of lebanon even unto the mount halak, that goeth up to
seir; which joshua gave unto the tribe of israel for a possession
accord to their divisions; 12:8 In the mountains, and in the
valleys, and in the plains, and in the springs, and in the wilderness,
and in the south country; the hittites, the amorites, and the
canaanites, the perizzites, the hivites, and the jebusites: 12:9 the
k of jericho, one; the king of ai, which is besid bethel, one;
12:10 the king of jerusalem, one; the king of hebron, one; 12:11 the
k of jarmuth, one; the king of lachish, one; 12:12 the king of
eglon, one; the king of gezer, one; 12:13 the king of debir, one; the
k of geder, one; 12:14 the king of hormah, one; the king of arad,
one; 12:15 the king of libnah, one; the king of adullam, one; 12:16
the king of makkedah, one; the king of bethel, one; 12:17 the king of
tappuah, one; the king of hepher, one; 12:18 the king of aphek, one;
th king of lasharon, one; 12:19 the king of madon, one; the king of
hazor, one; 12:20 the king of shimronmeron, one; the king of achshaph,
one; 12:21 the king of taanach, one; the king of megiddo, one; 12:22
the king of kedesh, one; the king of jokneam of carmel, one; 12:23 the
k of dor in the coast of dor, one; the king of the nation of
gilgal, one; 12:24 the king of tirzah, one: all the king thirti and
one.

13:1 now joshua wa old and stricken in years; and the lord said unto
him, thou art old and stricken in years, and there remaineth yet very
much land to be possessed.

13:2 thi is the land that yet remaineth: all the border of the
philistines, and all geshuri, 13:3 from sihor, which is befor egypt,
even unto the border of ekron northward, which is count to the
canaanite: five lord of the philistines; the gazathites, and the
ashdothites, the eshkalonites, the gittites, and the ekronites; also
th avites: 13:4 from the south, all the land of the canaanites, and
mearah that is besid the sidonian unto aphek, to the border of the
amorites: 13:5 and the land of the giblites, and all lebanon, toward
th sunrising, from baalgad under mount hermon unto the enter into
hamath.

13:6 all the inhabit of the hill countri from lebanon unto
misrephothmaim, and all the sidonians, them will I drive out from
befor the children of israel: onli divid thou it by lot unto the
israelit for an inheritance, as I have command thee.

13:7 now therefor divid thi land for an inherit unto the nine
tribes, and the half tribe of manasseh, 13:8 with whom the reubenites
and the gadit have receiv their inheritance, which mose gave
them, beyond jordan eastward, even as mose the servant of the lord
gav them; 13:9 from aroer, that is upon the bank of the river arnon,
and the citi that is in the midst of the river, and all the plain of
medeba unto dibon; 13:10 and all the citi of sihon king of the
amorites, which reign in heshbon, unto the border of the children of
ammon; 13:11 and gilead, and the border of the geshurit and
maachathites, and all mount hermon, and all bashan unto salcah; 13:12
all the kingdom of Og in bashan, which reign in ashtaroth and in
edrei, who remain of the remnant of the giants: for these did moses
smite, and cast them out.

13:13 nevertheless the children of israel expel not the geshurites,
nor the maachathites: but the geshurit and the maachathit dwell
among the israelit until thi day.

13:14 onli unto the tribe of levi he gave none inheritance; the
sacrific of the lord god of israel made by fire are their
inheritance, as he said unto them.

13:15 and mose gave unto the tribe of the children of reuben
inherit accord to their families.

13:16 and their coast wa from aroer, that is on the bank of the river
arnon, and the citi that is in the midst of the river, and all the
plain by medeba; 13:17 heshbon, and all her citi that are in the
plain; dibon, and bamothbaal, and bethbaalmeon, 13:18 and jahaza, and
kedemoth, and mephaath, 13:19 and kirjathaim, and sibmah, and
zarethshahar in the mount of the valley, 13:20 and bethpeor, and
ashdothpisgah, and bethjeshimoth, 13:21 and all the citi of the
plain, and all the kingdom of sihon king of the amorites, which
reign in heshbon, whom mose smote with the princ of midian, evi,
and rekem, and zur, and hur, and reba, which were duke of sihon,
dwel in the country.

13:22 balaam also the son of beor, the soothsayer, did the children of
israel slay with the sword among them that were slain by them.

13:23 and the border of the children of reuben wa jordan, and the
bord thereof. thi wa the inherit of the children of reuben
aft their families, the citi and the villag thereof.

13:24 and mose gave inherit unto the tribe of gad, even unto the
children of gad accord to their families.

13:25 and their coast wa jazer, and all the citi of gilead, and
half the land of the children of ammon, unto aroer that is before
rabbah; 13:26 and from heshbon unto ramathmizpeh, and betonim; and
from mahanaim unto the border of debir; 13:27 and in the valley,
betharam, and bethnimrah, and succoth, and zaphon, the rest of the
kingdom of sihon king of heshbon, jordan and hi border, even unto the
edg of the sea of chinnereth on the other side jordan eastward.

13:28 thi is the inherit of the children of gad after their
families, the cities, and their villages.

13:29 and mose gave inherit unto the half tribe of manasseh: and
thi wa the possess of the half tribe of the children of manasseh
bi their families.
