13:30 and their coast wa from mahanaim, all bashan, all the kingdom
of Og king of bashan, and all the town of jair, which are in bashan,
threescor cities: 13:31 and half gilead, and ashtaroth, and edrei,
c of the kingdom of Og in bashan, were pertain unto the
children of machir the son of manasseh, even to the one half of the
children of machir by their families.

13:32 these are the countri which mose did distribut for
inherit in the plain of moab, on the other side jordan, by
jericho, eastward.

13:33 but unto the tribe of levi mose gave not ani inheritance: the
lord god of israel wa their inheritance, as he said unto them.

14:1 and these are the countri which the children of israel
inherit in the land of canaan, which eleazar the priest, and joshua
th son of nun, and the head of the father of the tribe of the
children of israel, distribut for inherit to them.

14:2 By lot wa their inheritance, as the lord command by the hand
of moses, for the nine tribes, and for the half tribe.

14:3 for mose had given the inherit of two tribe and an half
trib on the other side jordan: but unto the levit he gave none
inherit among them.

14:4 for the children of joseph were two tribes, manasseh and ephraim:
therefor they gave no part unto the levit in the land, save cities
to dwell in, with their suburb for their cattl and for their
substance.

14:5 As the lord command moses, so the children of israel did, and
they divid the land.

14:6 then the children of judah came unto joshua in gilgal: and caleb
th son of jephunneh the kenezit said unto him, thou knowest the
th that the lord said unto mose the man of god concern me and
the in kadeshbarnea.

14:7 forti year old wa I when mose the servant of the lord sent me
from kadeshbarnea to espi out the land; and I brought him word again
a it wa in mine heart.

14:8 nevertheless my brethren that went up with me made the heart of
th peopl melt: but I wholli follow the lord my god.

14:9 and mose sware on that day, saying, sure the land whereon thy
feet have trodden shall be thine inheritance, and thi children' for
ever, becaus thou hast wholli follow the lord my god.

14:10 and now, behold, the lord hath kept me alive, as he said, these
forti and five years, even sinc the lord spake thi word unto moses,
whil the children of israel wander in the wilderness: and now, lo,
i am thi day fourscor and five year old.

14:11 As yet I am as strong thi day as I wa in the day that moses
s me: as my strength wa then, even so is my strength now, for war,
both to go out, and to come in.

14:12 now therefor give me thi mountain, whereof the lord spake in
that day; for thou heardest in that day how the anakim were there,
and that the citi were great and fenced: if so be the lord will be
with me, then I shall be abl to drive them out, as the lord said.

14:13 and joshua bless him, and gave unto caleb the son of jephunneh
hebron for an inheritance.

14:14 hebron therefor becam the inherit of caleb the son of
jephunneh the kenezit unto thi day, becaus that he wholli followed
th lord god of israel.

14:15 and the name of hebron befor wa kirjatharba; which arba wa a
great man among the anakims. and the land had rest from war.

15:1 thi then wa the lot of the tribe of the children of judah by
their families; even to the border of edom the wilder of zin
southward wa the uttermost part of the south coast.

15:2 and their south border wa from the shore of the salt sea, from
th bay that looketh southward: 15:3 and it went out to the south side
to maalehacrabbim, and pass along to zin, and ascend up on the
south side unto kadeshbarnea, and pass along to hezron, and went up
to adar, and fetch a compass to karkaa: 15:4 from thenc it passed
toward azmon, and went out unto the river of egypt; and the go out
of that coast were at the sea: thi shall be your south coast.

15:5 and the east border wa the salt sea, even unto the end of
jordan.

and their border in the north quarter wa from the bay of the sea at
th uttermost part of jordan: 15:6 and the border went up to
bethhogla, and pass along by the north of betharabah; and the border
w up to the stone of bohan the son of reuben: 15:7 and the border
w up toward debir from the valley of achor, and so northward,
look toward gilgal, that is befor the go up to adummim, which
i on the south side of the river: and the border pass toward the
wat of enshemesh, and the go out thereof were at enrogel: 15:8
and the border went up by the valley of the son of hinnom unto the
south side of the jebusite; the same is jerusalem: and the border went
up to the top of the mountain that lieth befor the valley of hinnom
westward, which is at the end of the valley of the giant northward:
15:9 and the border wa drawn from the top of the hill unto the
fountain of the water of nephtoah, and went out to the citi of mount
ephron; and the border wa drawn to baalah, which is kirjathjearim:
15:10 and the border compass from baalah westward unto mount seir,
and pass along unto the side of mount jearim, which is chesalon, on
th north side, and went down to bethshemesh, and pass on to timnah:
15:11 and the border went out unto the side of ekron northward: and
th border wa drawn to shicron, and pass along to mount baalah, and
went out unto jabneel; and the go out of the border were at the
sea.

15:12 and the west border wa to the great sea, and the coast thereof.

thi is the coast of the children of judah round about accord to
their families.

15:13 and unto caleb the son of jephunneh he gave a part among the
children of judah, accord to the command of the lord to joshua,
even the citi of arba the father of anak, which citi is hebron.

15:14 and caleb drove thenc the three son of anak, sheshai, and
ahiman, and talmai, the children of anak.

15:15 and he went up thenc to the inhabit of debir: and the name
of debir befor wa kirjathsepher.

15:16 and caleb said, He that smiteth kirjathsepher, and taketh it, to
him will I give achsah my daughter to wife.

15:17 and othniel the son of kenaz, the brother of caleb, took it: and
h gave him achsah hi daughter to wife.

15:18 and it came to pass, as she came unto him, that she move him to
ask of her father a field: and she light off her ass; and caleb said
unto her, what wouldest thou?  15:19 who answered, give me a blessing;
for thou hast given me a south land; give me also spring of water.
and he gave her the upper springs, and the nether springs.

15:20 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the children of judah
accord to their families.

15:21 and the uttermost citi of the tribe of the children of judah
toward the coast of edom southward were kabzeel, and eder, and jagur,
15:22 and kinah, and dimonah, and adadah, 15:23 and kedesh, and hazor,
and ithnan, 15:24 ziph, and telem, and bealoth, 15:25 and hazor,
hadattah, and kerioth, and hezron, which is hazor, 15:26 amam, and
shema, and moladah, 15:27 and hazargaddah, and heshmon, and bethpalet,
15:28 and hazarshual, and beersheba, and bizjothjah, 15:29 baalah, and
iim, and azem, 15:30 and eltolad, and chesil, and hormah, 15:31 and
ziklag, and madmannah, and sansannah, 15:32 and lebaoth, and shilhim,
and ain, and rimmon: all the citi are twenti and nine, with their
villages: 15:33 and in the valley, eshtaol, and zoreah, and ashnah,
15:34 and zanoah, and engannim, tappuah, and enam, 15:35 jarmuth, and
adullam, socoh, and azekah, 15:36 and sharaim, and adithaim, and
gederah, and gederothaim; fourteen citi with their villages: 15:37
zenan, and hadashah, and migdalgad, 15:38 and dilean, and mizpeh, and
joktheel, 15:39 lachish, and bozkath, and eglon, 15:40 and cabbon, and
lahmam, and kithlish, 15:41 and gederoth, bethdagon, and naamah, and
makkedah; sixteen citi with their villages: 15:42 libnah, and ether,
and ashan, 15:43 and jiphtah, and ashnah, and nezib, 15:44 and keilah,
and achzib, and mareshah; nine citi with their villages: 15:45
ekron, with her town and her villages: 15:46 from ekron even unto the
sea, all that lay near ashdod, with their villages: 15:47 ashdod with
her town and her villages, gaza with her town and her villages, unto
th river of egypt, and the great sea, and the border thereof: 15:48
and in the mountains, shamir, and jattir, and socoh, 15:49 and dannah,
and kirjathsannah, which is debir, 15:50 and anab, and eshtemoh, and
anim, 15:51 and goshen, and holon, and giloh; eleven citi with their
villages: 15:52 arab, and dumah, and eshean, 15:53 and janum, and
bethtappuah, and aphekah, 15:54 and humtah, and kirjatharba, which is
hebron, and zior; nine citi with their villages: 15:55 maon, carmel,
and ziph, and juttah, 15:56 and jezreel, and jokdeam, and zanoah,
15:57 cain, gibeah, and timnah; ten citi with their villages: 15:58
halhul, bethzur, and gedor, 15:59 and maarath, and bethanoth, and
eltekon; six citi with their villages: 15:60 kirjathbaal, which is
kirjathjearim, and rabbah; two citi with their villages: 15:61 in
th wilderness, betharabah, middin, and secacah, 15:62 and nibshan,
and the citi of salt, and engedi; six citi with their villages.

15:63 As for the jebusit the inhabit of jerusalem, the children
of judah could not drive them out; but the jebusit dwell with the
children of judah at jerusalem unto thi day.

16:1 and the lot of the children of joseph fell from jordan by
jericho, unto the water of jericho on the east, to the wilder that
goeth up from jericho throughout mount bethel, 16:2 and goeth out from
bethel to luz, and passeth along unto the border of archi to ataroth,
16:3 and goeth down westward to the coast of japhleti, unto the coast
of bethhoron the nether, and to gezer; and the go out thereof are
at the sea.

16:4 So the children of joseph, manasseh and ephraim, took their
inheritance.

16:5 and the border of the children of ephraim accord to their
famili wa thus: even the border of their inherit on the east
sid wa atarothaddar, unto bethhoron the upper; 16:6 and the border
w out toward the sea to michmethah on the north side; and the
bord went about eastward unto taanathshiloh, and pass by it on the
east to janohah; 16:7 and it went down from janohah to ataroth, and to
naarath, and came to jericho, and went out at jordan.

16:8 the border went out from tappuah westward unto the river kanah;
and the go out thereof were at the sea. thi is the inherit of
th tribe of the children of ephraim by their families.

16:9 and the separ citi for the children of ephraim were among
th inherit of the children of manasseh, all the citi with their
villages.

16:10 and they drave not out the canaanit that dwelt in gezer: but
th canaanit dwell among the ephraimit unto thi day, and serve
und tribute.

17:1 there wa also a lot for the tribe of manasseh; for he wa the
firstborn of joseph; to wit, for machir the firstborn of manasseh, the
fath of gilead: becaus he wa a man of war, therefor he had gilead
and bashan.

17:2 there wa also a lot for the rest of the children of manasseh by
their families; for the children of abiezer, and for the children of
helek, and for the children of asriel, and for the children of
shechem, and for the children of hepher, and for the children of
shemida: these were the male children of manasseh the son of joseph by
their families.

17:3 but zelophehad, the son of hepher, the son of gilead, the son of
machir, the son of manasseh, had no sons, but daughters: and these are
th name of hi daughters, mahlah, and noah, hoglah, milcah, and
tirzah.

17:4 and they came near befor eleazar the priest, and befor joshua
th son of nun, and befor the princes, saying, the lord commanded
mos to give us an inherit among our brethren. therefore
accord to the command of the lord he gave them an inheritance
among the brethren of their father.

17:5 and there fell ten portion to manasseh, besid the land of
gilead and bashan, which were on the other side jordan; 17:6 because
th daughter of manasseh had an inherit among hi sons: and the
rest of manasseh' son had the land of gilead.

17:7 and the coast of manasseh wa from asher to michmethah, that
lieth befor shechem; and the border went along on the right hand unto
th inhabit of entappuah.

17:8 now manasseh had the land of tappuah: but tappuah on the border
of manasseh belong to the children of ephraim; 17:9 and the coast
descend unto the river kanah, southward of the river: these cities
of ephraim are among the citi of manasseh: the coast of manasseh
also wa on the north side of the river, and the outgo of it were
at the sea: 17:10 southward it wa ephraim's, and northward it was
manasseh's, and the sea is hi border; and they met togeth in asher
on the north, and in issachar on the east.

17:11 and manasseh had in issachar and in asher bethshean and her
towns, and ibleam and her towns, and the inhabit of dor and her
towns, and the inhabit of endor and her towns, and the inhabitants
of taanach and her towns, and the inhabit of megiddo and her
towns, even three countries.

17:12 yet the children of manasseh could not drive out the inhabitants
of those cities; but the canaanit would dwell in that land.

17:13 yet it came to pass, when the children of israel were waxen
strong, that they put the canaanit to tribute, but did not utterly
dr them out.

17:14 and the children of joseph spake unto joshua, saying, whi hast
thou given me but one lot and one portion to inherit, see I am a
great people, forasmuch as the lord hath bless me hitherto?  17:15
and joshua answer them, If thou be a great people, then get thee up
to the wood country, and cut down for thyself there in the land of the
perizzit and of the giants, if mount ephraim be too narrow for thee.

17:16 and the children of joseph said, the hill is not enough for us:
and all the canaanit that dwell in the land of the valley have
chariot of iron, both they who are of bethshean and her towns, and
they who are of the valley of jezreel.

17:17 and joshua spake unto the hous of joseph, even to ephraim and
to manasseh, saying, thou art a great people, and hast great power:
th shalt not have one lot only: 17:18 but the mountain shall be
thine; for it is a wood, and thou shalt cut it down: and the outgoings
of it shall be thine: for thou shalt drive out the canaanites, though
they have iron chariots, and though they be strong.

18:1 and the whole congreg of the children of israel assembled
togeth at shiloh, and set up the tabernacl of the congregation
there. and the land wa subdu befor them.

18:2 and there remain among the children of israel seven tribes,
which had not yet receiv their inheritance.

18:3 and joshua said unto the children of israel, how long are ye
slack to go to possess the land, which the lord god of your fathers
hath given you?  18:4 give out from among you three men for each
tribe: and I will send them, and they shall rise, and go through the
land, and describ it accord to the inherit of them; and they
shal come again to me.

18:5 and they shall divid it into seven parts: judah shall abid in
their coast on the south, and the hous of joseph shall abid in their
coast on the north.

18:6 Ye shall therefor describ the land into seven parts, and bring
th descript hither to me, that I may cast lot for you here before
th lord our god.

18:7 but the levit have no part among you; for the priesthood of the
lord is their inheritance: and gad, and reuben, and half the tribe of
manasseh, have receiv their inherit beyond jordan on the east,
which mose the servant of the lord gave them.

18:8 and the men arose, and went away: and joshua charg them that
went to describ the land, saying, Go and walk through the land, and
describ it, and come again to me, that I may here cast lot for you
befor the lord in shiloh.

18:9 and the men went and pass through the land, and describ it by
citi into seven part in a book, and came again to joshua to the
host at shiloh.

18:10 and joshua cast lot for them in shiloh befor the lord: and
ther joshua divid the land unto the children of israel accord to
their divisions.

18:11 and the lot of the tribe of the children of benjamin came up
accord to their families: and the coast of their lot came forth
between the children of judah and the children of joseph.

18:12 and their border on the north side wa from jordan; and the
bord went up to the side of jericho on the north side, and went up
through the mountain westward; and the go out thereof were at the
wild of bethaven.

18:13 and the border went over from thenc toward luz, to the side of
luz, which is bethel, southward; and the border descend to
atarothadar, near the hill that lieth on the south side of the nether
bethhoron.

18:14 and the border wa drawn thence, and compass the corner of the
sea southward, from the hill that lieth befor bethhoron southward;
and the go out thereof were at kirjathbaal, which is
kirjathjearim, a citi of the children of judah: thi wa the west
quarter.

18:15 and the south quarter wa from the end of kirjathjearim, and the
bord went out on the west, and went out to the well of water of
nephtoah: 18:16 and the border came down to the end of the mountain
that lieth befor the valley of the son of hinnom, and which is in the
valley of the giant on the north, and descend to the valley of
hinnom, to the side of jebusi on the south, and descend to enrogel,
18:17 and wa drawn from the north, and went forth to enshemesh, and
went forth toward geliloth, which is over against the go up of
adummim, and descend to the stone of bohan the son of reuben, 18:18
and pass along toward the side over against arabah northward, and
went down unto arabah: 18:19 and the border pass along to the side
of bethhoglah northward: and the outgo of the border were at the
north bay of the salt sea at the south end of jordan: thi wa the
south coast.

18:20 and jordan wa the border of it on the east side. thi wa the
inherit of the children of benjamin, by the coast thereof round
about, accord to their families.

18:21 now the citi of the tribe of the children of benjamin
accord to their famili were jericho, and bethhoglah, and the
valley of keziz, 18:22 and betharabah, and zemaraim, and bethel, 18:23
and avim, and pharah, and ophrah, 18:24 and chepharhaammonai, and
ophni, and gaba; twelv citi with their villages: 18:25 gibeon, and
ramah, and beeroth, 18:26 and mizpeh, and chephirah, and mozah, 18:27
and rekem, and irpeel, and taralah, 18:28 and zelah, eleph, and
jebusi, which is jerusalem, gibeath, and kirjath; fourteen citi with
their villages. thi is the inherit of the children of benjamin
accord to their families.

19:1 and the second lot came forth to simeon, even for the tribe of
th children of simeon accord to their families: and their
inherit wa within the inherit of the children of judah.

19:2 and they had in their inherit beersheba, and sheba, and
moladah, 19:3 and hazarshual, and balah, and azem, 19:4 and eltolad,
and bethul, and hormah, 19:5 and ziklag, and bethmarcaboth, and
hazarsusah, 19:6 and bethlebaoth, and sharuhen; thirteen citi and
their villages: 19:7 ain, remmon, and ether, and ashan; four cities
and their villages: 19:8 and all the villag that were round about
thes citi to baalathbeer, ramath of the south. thi is the
inherit of the tribe of the children of simeon accord to their
families.

19:9 out of the portion of the children of judah wa the inheritance
of the children of simeon: for the part of the children of judah was
too much for them: therefor the children of simeon had their
inherit within the inherit of them.

19:10 and the third lot came up for the children of zebulun according
to their families: and the border of their inherit wa unto sarid:
19:11 and their border went up toward the sea, and maralah, and
reach to dabbasheth, and reach to the river that is before
jokneam; 19:12 and turn from sarid eastward toward the sunrising
unto the border of chislothtabor, and then goeth out to daberath, and
goeth up to japhia, 19:13 and from thenc passeth on along on the east
to gittahhepher, to ittahkazin, and goeth out to remmonmethoar to
neah; 19:14 and the border compasseth it on the north side to
hannathon: and the outgo thereof are in the valley of jiphthahel:
19:15 and kattath, and nahallal, and shimron, and idalah, and
bethlehem: twelv citi with their villages.

19:16 thi is the inherit of the children of zebulun accord to
their families, these citi with their villages.

19:17 and the fourth lot came out to issachar, for the children of
issachar accord to their families.

19:18 and their border wa toward jezreel, and chesulloth, and shunem,
19:19 and haphraim, and shihon, and anaharath, 19:20 and rabbith, and
kishion, and abez, 19:21 and remeth, and engannim, and enhaddah, and
bethpazzez; 19:22 and the coast reacheth to tabor, and shahazimah, and
bethshemesh; and the outgo of their border were at jordan: sixteen
c with their villages.

19:23 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the children of issachar
accord to their families, the citi and their villages.

19:24 and the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of
ash accord to their families.

19:25 and their border wa helkath, and hali, and beten, and achshaph,
19:26 and alammelech, and amad, and misheal; and reacheth to carmel
westward, and to shihorlibnath; 19:27 and turneth toward the sunrising
to bethdagon, and reacheth to zebulun, and to the valley of jiphthahel
toward the north side of bethemek, and neiel, and goeth out to cabul
on the left hand, 19:28 and hebron, and rehob, and hammon, and kanah,
even unto great zidon; 19:29 and then the coast turneth to ramah, and
to the strong citi tyre; and the coast turneth to hosah; and the
outgo thereof are at the sea from the coast to achzib: 19:30 ummah
also, and aphek, and rehob: twenti and two citi with their villages.

19:31 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the children of asher
accord to their families, these citi with their villages.

19:32 the sixth lot came out to the children of naphtali, even for the
children of naphtali accord to their families.

19:33 and their coast wa from heleph, from allon to zaanannim, and
adami, nekeb, and jabneel, unto lakum; and the outgo thereof were
at jordan: 19:34 and then the coast turneth westward to aznothtabor,
and goeth out from thenc to hukkok, and reacheth to zebulun on the
south side, and reacheth to asher on the west side, and to judah upon
jordan toward the sunrising.

19:35 and the fenc citi are ziddim, zer, and hammath, rakkath, and
chinnereth, 19:36 and adamah, and ramah, and hazor, 19:37 and kedesh,
and edrei, and enhazor, 19:38 and iron, and migdalel, horem, and
bethanath, and bethshemesh; nineteen citi with their villages.

19:39 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the children of naphtali
accord to their families, the citi and their villages.

19:40 and the seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of
dan accord to their families.

19:41 and the coast of their inherit wa zorah, and eshtaol, and
irshemesh, 19:42 and shaalabbin, and ajalon, and jethlah, 19:43 and
elon, and thimnathah, and ekron, 19:44 and eltekeh, and gibbethon, and
baalath, 19:45 and jehud, and beneberak, and gathrimmon, 19:46 and
mejarkon, and rakkon, with the border befor japho.

19:47 and the coast of the children of dan went out too littl for
them: therefor the children of dan went up to fight against leshem,
and took it, and smote it with the edg of the sword, and possessed
it, and dwelt therein, and call leshem, dan, after the name of dan
their father.

19:48 thi is the inherit of the tribe of the children of dan
accord to their families, these citi with their villages.

19:49 when they had made an end of divid the land for inheritance
bi their coasts, the children of israel gave an inherit to joshua
th son of nun among them: 19:50 accord to the word of the lord
they gave him the citi which he asked, even timnathserah in mount
ephraim: and he built the city, and dwelt therein.

19:51 these are the inheritances, which eleazar the priest, and joshua
th son of nun, and the head of the father of the tribe of the
children of israel, divid for an inherit by lot in shiloh before
th lord, at the door of the tabernacl of the congregation. So they
mad an end of divid the country.

20:1 the lord also spake unto joshua, saying, 20:2 speak to the
children of israel, saying, appoint out for you citi of refuge,
whereof I spake unto you by the hand of moses: 20:3 that the slayer
that killeth ani person unawar and unwittingli may flee thither: and
they shall be your refug from the aveng of blood.

20:4 and when he that doth flee unto one of those citi shall stand
at the enter of the gate of the city, and shall declar hi cause
in the ear of the elder of that city, they shall take him into the
citi unto them, and give him a place, that he may dwell among them.

20:5 and if the aveng of blood pursu after him, then they shall not
deliv the slayer up into hi hand; becaus he smote hi neighbour
unwittingly, and hate him not beforetime.

20:6 and he shall dwell in that city, until he stand befor the
congreg for judgment, and until the death of the high priest that
shal be in those days: then shall the slayer return, and come unto
hi own city, and unto hi own house, unto the citi from whenc he
fled.

20:7 and they appoint kedesh in galile in mount naphtali, and
shechem in mount ephraim, and kirjatharba, which is hebron, in the
mountain of judah.

20:8 and on the other side jordan by jericho eastward, they assigned
bez in the wilder upon the plain out of the tribe of reuben, and
ramoth in gilead out of the tribe of gad, and golan in bashan out of
th tribe of manasseh.

20:9 these were the citi appoint for all the children of israel,
and for the stranger that sojourneth among them, that whosoever
killeth ani person at unawar might flee thither, and not die by the
hand of the aveng of blood, until he stood befor the congregation.

21:1 then came near the head of the father of the levit unto
eleazar the priest, and unto joshua the son of nun, and unto the heads
of the father of the tribe of the children of israel; 21:2 and they
spak unto them at shiloh in the land of canaan, saying, the lord
command by the hand of mose to give us citi to dwell in, with the
suburb thereof for our cattle.

21:3 and the children of israel gave unto the levit out of their
inheritance, at the command of the lord, these citi and their
suburbs.

21:4 and the lot came out for the famili of the kohathites: and the
children of aaron the priest, which were of the levites, had by lot
out of the tribe of judah, and out of the tribe of simeon, and out of
th tribe of benjamin, thirteen cities.

21:5 and the rest of the children of kohath had by lot out of the
famili of the tribe of ephraim, and out of the tribe of dan, and out
of the half tribe of manasseh, ten cities.

21:6 and the children of gershon had by lot out of the famili of the
trib of issachar, and out of the tribe of asher, and out of the tribe
of naphtali, and out of the half tribe of manasseh in bashan, thirteen
cities.

21:7 the children of merari by their famili had out of the tribe of
reuben, and out of the tribe of gad, and out of the tribe of zebulun,
twelv cities.

21:8 and the children of israel gave by lot unto the levit these
c with their suburbs, as the lord command by the hand of moses.

21:9 and they gave out of the tribe of the children of judah, and out
of the tribe of the children of simeon, these citi which are here
ment by name.

21:10 which the children of aaron, be of the famili of the
kohathites, who were of the children of levi, had: for their wa the
first lot.

21:11 and they gave them the citi of arba the father of anak, which
citi is hebron, in the hill countri of judah, with the suburb thereof
round about it.

21:12 but the field of the city, and the villag thereof, gave they
to caleb the son of jephunneh for hi possession.

21:13 thu they gave to the children of aaron the priest hebron with
her suburbs, to be a citi of refug for the slayer; and libnah with
her suburbs, 21:14 and jattir with her suburbs, and eshtemoa with her
suburbs, 21:15 and holon with her suburbs, and debir with her suburbs,
21:16 and ain with her suburbs, and juttah with her suburbs, and
bethshemesh with her suburbs; nine citi out of those two tribes.

21:17 and out of the tribe of benjamin, gibeon with her suburbs, geba
with her suburbs, 21:18 anathoth with her suburbs, and almon with her
suburbs; four cities.

21:19 all the citi of the children of aaron, the priests, were
thirteen citi with their suburbs.

21:20 and the famili of the children of kohath, the levit which
remain of the children of kohath, even they had the citi of their
lot out of the tribe of ephraim.

21:21 for they gave them shechem with her suburb in mount ephraim, to
b a citi of refug for the slayer; and gezer with her suburbs, 21:22
and kibzaim with her suburbs, and bethhoron with her suburbs; four
cities.

21:23 and out of the tribe of dan, eltekeh with her suburbs, gibbethon
with her suburbs, 21:24 aijalon with her suburbs, gathrimmon with her
suburbs; four cities.

21:25 and out of the half tribe of manasseh, tanach with her suburbs,
and gathrimmon with her suburbs; two cities.

21:26 all the citi were ten with their suburb for the famili of
th children of kohath that remained.

21:27 and unto the children of gershon, of the famili of the
levites, out of the other half tribe of manasseh they gave golan in
bashan with her suburbs, to be a citi of refug for the slayer; and
beeshterah with her suburbs; two cities.

21:28 and out of the tribe of issachar, kishon with her suburbs,
dabareh with her suburbs, 21:29 jarmuth with her suburbs, engannim
with her suburbs; four cities.

21:30 and out of the tribe of asher, mishal with her suburbs, abdon
with her suburbs, 21:31 helkath with her suburbs, and rehob with her
suburbs; four cities.

21:32 and out of the tribe of naphtali, kedesh in galile with her
suburbs, to be a citi of refug for the slayer; and hammothdor with
her suburbs, and kartan with her suburbs; three cities.

21:33 all the citi of the gershonit accord to their families
wer thirteen citi with their suburbs.

21:34 and unto the famili of the children of merari, the rest of the
levites, out of the tribe of zebulun, jokneam with her suburbs, and
kartah with her suburbs, 21:35 dimnah with her suburbs, nahal with
her suburbs; four cities.

21:36 and out of the tribe of reuben, bezer with her suburbs, and
jahazah with her suburbs, 21:37 kedemoth with her suburbs, and
mephaath with her suburbs; four cities.

21:38 and out of the tribe of gad, ramoth in gilead with her suburbs,
to be a citi of refug for the slayer; and mahanaim with her suburbs,
21:39 heshbon with her suburbs, jazer with her suburbs; four citi in
all.

21:40 So all the citi for the children of merari by their families,
which were remain of the famili of the levites, were by their lot
twelv cities.

21:41 all the citi of the levit within the possess of the
children of israel were forti and eight citi with their suburbs.

21:42 these citi were everi one with their suburb round about them:
thu were all these cities.

21:43 and the lord gave unto israel all the land which he sware to
giv unto their fathers; and they possess it, and dwelt therein.

21:44 and the lord gave them rest round about, accord to all that
h sware unto their fathers: and there stood not a man of all their
enemi befor them; the lord deliv all their enemi into their
hand.

21:45 there fail not ought of ani good thing which the lord had
spoken unto the hous of israel; all came to pass.

22:1 then joshua call the reubenites, and the gadites, and the half
trib of manasseh, 22:2 and said unto them, Ye have kept all that
mos the servant of the lord command you, and have obey my voice
in all that I command you: 22:3 Ye have not left your brethren these
mani day unto thi day, but have kept the charg of the commandment
of the lord your god.

22:4 and now the lord your god hath given rest unto your brethren, as
h promis them: therefor now return ye, and get you unto your
tents, and unto the land of your possession, which mose the servant
of the lord gave you on the other side jordan.

22:5 but take dilig heed to do the command and the law, which
mos the servant of the lord charg you, to love the lord your god,
and to walk in all hi ways, and to keep hi commandments, and to
cleav unto him, and to serv him with all your heart and with all
your soul.

22:6 So joshua bless them, and sent them away: and they went unto
their tents.

22:7 now to the one half of the tribe of manasseh mose had given
possess in bashan: but unto the other half thereof gave joshua
among their brethren on thi side jordan westward. and when joshua
s them away also unto their tents, then he bless them, 22:8 and
h spake unto them, saying, return with much rich unto your tents,
and with veri much cattle, with silver, and with gold, and with brass,
and with iron, and with veri much raiment: divid the spoil of your
enemi with your brethren.

22:9 and the children of reuben and the children of gad and the half
trib of manasseh returned, and depart from the children of israel
out of shiloh, which is in the land of canaan, to go unto the country
of gilead, to the land of their possession, whereof they were
possessed, accord to the word of the lord by the hand of moses.

22:10 and when they came unto the border of jordan, that are in the
land of canaan, the children of reuben and the children of gad and the
half tribe of manasseh built there an altar by jordan, a great altar
to see to.

22:11 and the children of israel heard say, behold, the children of
reuben and the children of gad and the half tribe of manasseh have
built an altar over against the land of canaan, in the border of
jordan, at the passag of the children of israel.

22:12 and when the children of israel heard of it, the whole
congreg of the children of israel gather themselv togeth at
shiloh, to go up to war against them.

22:13 and the children of israel sent unto the children of reuben, and
to the children of gad, and to the half tribe of manasseh, into the
land of gilead, phineha the son of eleazar the priest, 22:14 and with
him ten princes, of each chief hous a princ throughout all the
trib of israel; and each one wa an head of the hous of their
fath among the thousand of israel.

22:15 and they came unto the children of reuben, and to the children
of gad, and to the half tribe of manasseh, unto the land of gilead,
and they spake with them, saying, 22:16 thu saith the whole
congreg of the lord, what trespass is thi that ye have committed
against the god of israel, to turn away thi day from follow the
lord, in that ye have build you an altar, that ye might rebel this
day against the lord?  22:17 Is the iniqu of peor too littl for
us, from which we are not cleans until thi day, although there was
a plagu in the congreg of the lord, 22:18 but that ye must turn
away thi day from follow the lord? and it will be, see ye rebel
to day against the lord, that to morrow he will be wroth with the
whol congreg of israel.

22:19 notwithstanding, if the land of your possess be unclean, then
pass ye over unto the land of the possess of the lord, wherein the
lord' tabernacl dwelleth, and take possess among us: but rebel
not against the lord, nor rebel against us, in build you an altar
besid the altar of the lord our god.

22:20 did not achan the son of zerah commit a trespass in the accursed
thing, and wrath fell on all the congreg of israel? and that man
perish not alon in hi iniquity.

22:21 then the children of reuben and the children of gad and the half
trib of manasseh answered, and said unto the head of the thousands
of israel, 22:22 the lord god of gods, the lord god of gods, he
knoweth, and israel he shall know; if it be in rebellion, or if in
transgress against the lord, (save us not thi day,) 22:23 that we
hav built us an altar to turn from follow the lord, or if to offer
thereon burnt offer or meat offering, or if to offer peace
off thereon, let the lord himself requir it; 22:24 and if we
hav not rather done it for fear of thi thing, saying, In time to
com your children might speak unto our children, saying, what have ye
to do with the lord god of israel?  22:25 for the lord hath made
jordan a border between us and you, ye children of reuben and children
of gad; ye have no part in the lord: so shall your children make our
children ceas from fear the lord.

22:26 therefor we said, let us now prepar to build us an altar, not
for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice: 22:27 but that it may be a
wit between us, and you, and our gener after us, that we
might do the servic of the lord befor him with our burnt offerings,
and with our sacrifices, and with our peac offerings; that your
children may not say to our children in time to come, Ye have no part
in the lord.

22:28 therefor said we, that it shall be, when they should so say to
u or to our gener in time to come, that we may say again,
behold the pattern of the altar of the lord, which our father made,
not for burnt offerings, nor for sacrifices; but it is a witness
between us and you.

22:29 god forbid that we should rebel against the lord, and turn this
day from follow the lord, to build an altar for burnt offerings,
for meat offerings, or for sacrifices, besid the altar of the lord
our god that is befor hi tabernacle.

22:30 and when phineha the priest, and the princ of the
congreg and head of the thousand of israel which were with him,
heard the word that the children of reuben and the children of gad
and the children of manasseh spake, it pleas them.

22:31 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest said unto the
children of reuben, and to the children of gad, and to the children of
manasseh, thi day we perceiv that the lord is among us, becaus ye
hav not commit thi trespass against the lord: now ye have
deliv the children of israel out of the hand of the lord.

22:32 and phineha the son of eleazar the priest, and the princes,
return from the children of reuben, and from the children of gad,
out of the land of gilead, unto the land of canaan, to the children of
israel, and brought them word again.

22:33 and the thing pleas the children of israel; and the children
of israel bless god, and did not intend to go up against them in
battle, to destroy the land wherein the children of reuben and gad
dwelt.

22:34 and the children of reuben and the children of gad call the
altar ed: for it shall be a wit between us that the lord is god.

23:1 and it came to pass a long time after that the lord had given
rest unto israel from all their enemi round about, that joshua waxed
old and stricken in age.

23:2 and joshua call for all israel, and for their elders, and for
their heads, and for their judges, and for their officers, and said
unto them, I am old and stricken in age: 23:3 and ye have seen all
that the lord your god hath done unto all these nation becaus of
you; for the lord your god is he that hath fought for you.

23:4 behold, I have divid unto you by lot these nation that remain,
to be an inherit for your tribes, from jordan, with all the
nat that I have cut off, even unto the great sea westward.

23:5 and the lord your god, he shall expel them from befor you, and
driv them from out of your sight; and ye shall possess their land, as
th lord your god hath promis unto you.

23:6 Be ye therefor veri courag to keep and to do all that is
written in the book of the law of moses, that ye turn not aside
therefrom to the right hand or to the left; 23:7 that ye come not
among these nations, these that remain among you; neither make mention
of the name of their gods, nor caus to swear by them, neither serve
them, nor bow yourselv unto them: 23:8 but cleav unto the lord your
god, as ye have done unto thi day.

23:9 for the lord hath driven out from befor you great nation and
strong: but as for you, no man hath been abl to stand befor you unto
thi day.

23:10 one man of you shall chase a thousand: for the lord your god, he
it is that fighteth for you, as he hath promis you.

23:11 take good heed therefor unto yourselves, that ye love the lord
your god.

23:12 els if ye do in ani wise go back, and cleav unto the remnant
of these nations, even these that remain among you, and shall make
marriag with them, and go in unto them, and they to you: 23:13 know
for a certainti that the lord your god will no more drive out ani of
thes nation from befor you; but they shall be snare and trap unto
you, and scourg in your sides, and thorn in your eyes, until ye
perish from off thi good land which the lord your god hath given you.

23:14 and, behold, thi day I am go the way of all the earth: and
y know in all your heart and in all your souls, that not one thing
hath fail of all the good thing which the lord your god spake
concern you; all are come to pass unto you, and not one thing hath
fail thereof.

23:15 therefor it shall come to pass, that as all good thing are
com upon you, which the lord your god promis you; so shall the lord
br upon you all evil things, until he have destroy you from off
thi good land which the lord your god hath given you.

23:16 when ye have transgress the coven of the lord your god,
which he command you, and have gone and serv other gods, and bowed
yourselv to them; then shall the anger of the lord be kindled
against you, and ye shall perish quickli from off the good land which
h hath given unto you.

24:1 and joshua gather all the tribe of israel to shechem, and
cal for the elder of israel, and for their heads, and for their
judges, and for their officers; and they present themselv before
god.

24:2 and joshua said unto all the people, thu saith the lord god of
israel, your father dwelt on the other side of the flood in old time,
even terah, the father of abraham, and the father of nachor: and they
serv other gods.

24:3 and I took your father abraham from the other side of the flood,
and led him throughout all the land of canaan, and multipli his
seed, and gave him isaac.

24:4 and I gave unto isaac jacob and esau: and I gave unto esau mount
seir, to possess it; but jacob and hi children went down into egypt.

24:5 I sent mose also and aaron, and I plagu egypt, accord to
that which I did among them: and afterward I brought you out.

24:6 and I brought your father out of egypt: and ye came unto the
sea; and the egyptian pursu after your father with chariot and
horsemen unto the red sea.

24:7 and when they cri unto the lord, he put dark between you
and the egyptians, and brought the sea upon them, and cover them;
and your eye have seen what I have done in egypt: and ye dwelt in the
wild a long season.

24:8 and I brought you into the land of the amorites, which dwelt on
th other side jordan; and they fought with you: and I gave them into
your hand, that ye might possess their land; and I destroy them from
befor you.

24:9 then balak the son of zippor, king of moab, aros and warred
against israel, and sent and call balaam the son of beor to curse
you: 24:10 but I would not hearken unto balaam; therefor he blessed
y still: so I deliv you out of hi hand.

24:11 and you went over jordan, and came unto jericho: and the men of
jericho fought against you, the amorites, and the perizzites, and the
canaanites, and the hittites, and the girgashites, the hivites, and
th jebusites; and I deliv them into your hand.

24:12 and I sent the hornet befor you, which drave them out from
befor you, even the two king of the amorites; but not with thy
sword, nor with thi bow.

24:13 and I have given you a land for which ye did not labour, and
citi which ye built not, and ye dwell in them; of the vineyard and
oliveyard which ye plant not do ye eat.

24:14 now therefor fear the lord, and serv him in sincer and in
truth: and put away the god which your father serv on the other
sid of the flood, and in egypt; and serv ye the lord.

24:15 and if it seem evil unto you to serv the lord, choos you this
day whom ye will serve; whether the god which your father served
that were on the other side of the flood, or the god of the amorites,
in whose land ye dwell: but as for me and my house, we will serv the
lord.

24:16 and the peopl answer and said, god forbid that we should
forsak the lord, to serv other gods; 24:17 for the lord our god, he
it is that brought us up and our father out of the land of egypt,
from the hous of bondage, and which did those great sign in our
sight, and preserv us in all the way wherein we went, and among all
th peopl through whom we passed: 24:18 and the lord drave out from
befor us all the people, even the amorit which dwelt in the land:
therefor will we also serv the lord; for he is our god.

24:19 and joshua said unto the people, Ye cannot serv the lord: for
h is an holi god; he is a jealou god; he will not forgiv your
transgress nor your sins.

24:20 If ye forsak the lord, and serv strang gods, then he will
turn and do you hurt, and consum you, after that he hath done you
good.

24:21 and the peopl said unto joshua, nay; but we will serv the
lord.

24:22 and joshua said unto the people, Ye are wit against
yourselv that ye have chosen you the lord, to serv him. and they
said, We are witnesses.

24:23 now therefor put away, said he, the strang god which are
among you, and inclin your heart unto the lord god of israel.

24:24 and the peopl said unto joshua, the lord our god will we serve,
and hi voic will we obey.

24:25 So joshua made a coven with the peopl that day, and set them
a statut and an ordin in shechem.

24:26 and joshua wrote these word in the book of the law of god, and
took a great stone, and set it up there under an oak, that wa by the
sanctuari of the lord.

24:27 and joshua said unto all the people, behold, thi stone shall be
a wit unto us; for it hath heard all the word of the lord which
h spake unto us: it shall be therefor a wit unto you, lest ye
deni your god.

24:28 So joshua let the peopl depart, everi man unto hi inheritance.

24:29 and it came to pass after these things, that joshua the son of
nun, the servant of the lord, died, be an hundr and ten years
old.

24:30 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in
timnathserah, which is in mount ephraim, on the north side of the hill
of gaash.

24:31 and israel serv the lord all the day of joshua, and all the
day of the elder that overliv joshua, and which had known all the
work of the lord, that he had done for israel.

24:32 and the bone of joseph, which the children of israel brought up
out of egypt, buri they in shechem, in a parcel of ground which
jacob bought of the son of hamor the father of shechem for an hundred
piec of silver: and it becam the inherit of the children of
joseph.

24:33 and eleazar the son of aaron died; and they buri him in a hill
that pertain to phineha hi son, which wa given him in mount
ephraim.




th book of judges


1:1 now after the death of joshua it came to pass, that the children
of israel ask the lord, saying, who shall go up for us against the
canaanit first, to fight against them?  1:2 and the lord said, judah
shal go up: behold, I have deliv the land into hi hand.

1:3 and judah said unto simeon hi brother, come up with me into my
lot, that we may fight against the canaanites; and I likewis will go
with thee into thi lot. So simeon went with him.

1:4 and judah went up; and the lord deliv the canaanit and the
perizzit into their hand: and they slew of them in bezek ten
thousand men.

1:5 and they found adonibezek in bezek: and they fought against him,
and they slew the canaanit and the perizzites.

1:6 but adonibezek fled; and they pursu after him, and caught him,
and cut off hi thumb and hi great toes.

1:7 and adonibezek said, threescor and ten kings, have their thumbs
and their great toe cut off, gather their meat under my table: as i
hav done, so god hath requit me. and they brought him to jerusalem,
and there he died.

1:8 now the children of judah had fought against jerusalem, and had
taken it, and smitten it with the edg of the sword, and set the city
on fire.

1:9 and afterward the children of judah went down to fight against the
canaanites, that dwelt in the mountain, and in the south, and in the
valley.

1:10 and judah went against the canaanit that dwelt in hebron: (now
th name of hebron befor wa kirjatharba:) and they slew sheshai, and
ahiman, and talmai.

1:11 and from thenc he went against the inhabit of debir: and the
nam of debir befor wa kirjathsepher: 1:12 and caleb said, He that
smiteth kirjathsepher, and taketh it, to him will I give achsah my
daught to wife.

1:13 and othniel the son of kenaz, caleb' younger brother, took it:
and he gave him achsah hi daughter to wife.

1:14 and it came to pass, when she came to him, that she move him to
ask of her father a field: and she light from off her ass; and caleb
said unto her, what wilt thou?  1:15 and she said unto him, give me a
blessing: for thou hast given me a south land; give me also spring of
water. and caleb gave her the upper spring and the nether springs.

1:16 and the children of the kenite, moses' father in law, went up out
of the citi of palm tree with the children of judah into the
wild of judah, which lieth in the south of arad; and they went
and dwelt among the people.

1:17 and judah went with simeon hi brother, and they slew the
canaanit that inhabit zephath, and utterli destroy it. and the
nam of the citi wa call hormah.

1:18 also judah took gaza with the coast thereof, and askelon with the
coast thereof, and ekron with the coast thereof.

1:19 and the lord wa with judah; and he drave out the inhabit of
th mountain; but could not drive out the inhabit of the valley,
becaus they had chariot of iron.

1:20 and they gave hebron unto caleb, as mose said: and he expelled
th the three son of anak.

1:21 and the children of benjamin did not drive out the jebusit that
inhabit jerusalem; but the jebusit dwell with the children of
benjamin in jerusalem unto thi day.

1:22 and the hous of joseph, they also went up against bethel: and
th lord wa with them.

1:23 and the hous of joseph sent to descri bethel. (now the name of
th citi befor wa luz.)  1:24 and the spi saw a man come forth out
of the city, and they said unto him, shew us, we pray thee, the
entr into the city, and we will shew thee mercy.

1:25 and when he shew them the entranc into the city, they smote
th citi with the edg of the sword; but they let go the man and all
hi family.

1:26 and the man went into the land of the hittites, and built a city,
and call the name thereof luz: which is the name thereof unto this
day.

1:27 neither did manasseh drive out the inhabit of bethshean and
her towns, nor taanach and her towns, nor the inhabit of dor and
her towns, nor the inhabit of ibleam and her towns, nor the
inhabit of megiddo and her towns: but the canaanit would dwell
in that land.

1:28 and it came to pass, when israel wa strong, that they put the
canaanit to tribute, and did not utterli drive them out.

1:29 neither did ephraim drive out the canaanit that dwelt in gezer;
but the canaanit dwelt in gezer among them.

1:30 neither did zebulun drive out the inhabit of kitron, nor the
inhabit of nahalol; but the canaanit dwelt among them, and
becam tributaries.

1:31 neither did asher drive out the inhabit of accho, nor the
inhabit of zidon, nor of ahlab, nor of achzib, nor of helbah, nor
of aphik, nor of rehob: 1:32 but the asherit dwelt among the
canaanites, the inhabit of the land: for they did not drive them
out.

1:33 neither did naphtali drive out the inhabit of bethshemesh,
nor the inhabit of bethanath; but he dwelt among the canaanites,
th inhabit of the land: nevertheless the inhabit of
bethshemesh and of bethanath becam tributari unto them.

1:34 and the amorit forc the children of dan into the mountain:
for they would not suffer them to come down to the valley: 1:35 but
th amorit would dwell in mount here in aijalon, and in shaalbim:
yet the hand of the hous of joseph prevailed, so that they became
tributaries.

1:36 and the coast of the amorit wa from the go up to akrabbim,
from the rock, and upward.

2:1 and an angel of the lord came up from gilgal to bochim, and said,
i made you to go up out of egypt, and have brought you unto the land
which I sware unto your fathers; and I said, I will never break my
coven with you.

2:2 and ye shall make no leagu with the inhabit of thi land; ye
shal throw down their altars: but ye have not obey my voice: why
hav ye done this?  2:3 wherefor I also said, I will not drive them
out from befor you; but they shall be as thorn in your sides, and
their god shall be a snare unto you.

2:4 and it came to pass, when the angel of the lord spake these words
unto all the children of israel, that the peopl lift up their
voice, and wept.

2:5 and they call the name of that place bochim: and they sacrificed
ther unto the lord.

2:6 and when joshua had let the peopl go, the children of israel went
everi man unto hi inherit to possess the land.

2:7 and the peopl serv the lord all the day of joshua, and all the
day of the elder that outliv joshua, who had seen all the great
work of the lord, that he did for israel.

2:8 and joshua the son of nun, the servant of the lord, died, be an
hundr and ten year old.

2:9 and they buri him in the border of hi inherit in
timnathheres, in the mount of ephraim, on the north side of the hill
gaash.

2:10 and also all that gener were gather unto their fathers:
and there aros anoth gener after them, which knew not the
lord, nor yet the work which he had done for israel.

2:11 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord, and
serv baalim: 2:12 and they forsook the lord god of their fathers,
which brought them out of the land of egypt, and follow other gods,
of the god of the peopl that were round about them, and bowed
themselv unto them, and provok the lord to anger.

2:13 and they forsook the lord, and serv baal and ashtaroth.

2:14 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel, and he
deliv them into the hand of spoiler that spoil them, and he
sold them into the hand of their enemi round about, so that they
could not ani longer stand befor their enemies.

2:15 whithersoev they went out, the hand of the lord wa against
them for evil, as the lord had said, and as the lord had sworn unto
them: and they were greatli distressed.

2:16 nevertheless the lord rais up judges, which deliv them out
of the hand of those that spoil them.

2:17 and yet they would not hearken unto their judges, but they went a
whor after other gods, and bow themselv unto them: they turned
quickli out of the way which their father walk in, obey the
command of the lord; but they did not so.

2:18 and when the lord rais them up judges, then the lord wa with
th judge, and deliv them out of the hand of their enemi all the
day of the judge: for it repent the lord becaus of their groanings
bi reason of them that oppress them and vex them.

2:19 and it came to pass, when the judg wa dead, that they returned,
and corrupt themselv more than their fathers, in follow other
god to serv them, and to bow down unto them; they ceas not from
their own doings, nor from their stubborn way.

2:20 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel; and he said,
becaus that thi peopl hath transgress my coven which i
command their fathers, and have not hearken unto my voice; 2:21 i
also will not henceforth drive out ani from befor them of the nations
which joshua left when he died: 2:22 that through them I may prove
israel, whether they will keep the way of the lord to walk therein, as
their father did keep it, or not.

2:23 therefor the lord left those nations, without drive them out
hastily; neither deliv he them into the hand of joshua.

3:1 now these are the nation which the lord left, to prove israel by
them, even as mani of israel as had not known all the war of canaan;
3:2 onli that the gener of the children of israel might know, to
teach them war, at the least such as befor knew noth thereof; 3:3
namely, five lord of the philistines, and all the canaanites, and the
sidonians, and the hivit that dwelt in mount lebanon, from mount
baalhermon unto the enter in of hamath.

3:4 and they were to prove israel by them, to know whether they would
hearken unto the command of the lord, which he command their
fath by the hand of moses.

3:5 and the children of israel dwelt among the canaanites, hittites,
and amorites, and perizzites, and hivites, and jebusites: 3:6 and they
took their daughter to be their wives, and gave their daughter to
their sons, and serv their gods.

3:7 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord, and
forgat the lord their god, and serv baalim and the groves.

3:8 therefor the anger of the lord wa hot against israel, and he
sold them into the hand of chushanrishathaim king of mesopotamia: and
th children of israel serv chushanrishathaim eight years.

3:9 and when the children of israel cri unto the lord, the lord
rais up a deliver to the children of israel, who deliv them,
even othniel the son of kenaz, caleb' younger brother.

3:10 and the spirit of the lord came upon him, and he judg israel,
and went out to war: and the lord deliv chushanrishathaim king of
mesopotamia into hi hand; and hi hand prevail against
chushanrishathaim.

3:11 and the land had rest forti years. and othniel the son of kenaz
died.

3:12 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord: and the lord strengthen eglon the king of moab against israel,
becaus they had done evil in the sight of the lord.

3:13 and he gather unto him the children of ammon and amalek, and
went and smote israel, and possess the citi of palm trees.

3:14 So the children of israel serv eglon the king of moab eighteen
years.

3:15 but when the children of israel cri unto the lord, the lord
rais them up a deliverer, ehud the son of gera, a benjamite, a man
lefthanded: and by him the children of israel sent a present unto
eglon the king of moab.

3:16 but ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit
length; and he did gird it under hi raiment upon hi right thigh.

3:17 and he brought the present unto eglon king of moab: and eglon was
a veri fat man.

3:18 and when he had made an end to offer the present, he sent away
th peopl that bare the present.

3:19 but he himself turn again from the quarri that were by
gilgal, and said, I have a secret errand unto thee, O king: who said,
keep silence. and all that stood by him went out from him.

3:20 and ehud came unto him; and he wa sit in a summer parlour,
which he had for himself alone. and ehud said, I have a messag from
god unto thee.

and he aros out of hi seat.

3:21 and ehud put forth hi left hand, and took the dagger from his
right thigh, and thrust it into hi belly: 3:22 and the haft also went
in after the blade; and the fat close upon the blade, so that he
could not draw the dagger out of hi belly; and the dirt came out.

3:23 then ehud went forth through the porch, and shut the door of the
parlour upon him, and lock them.

3:24 when he wa gone out, hi servant came; and when they saw that,
behold, the door of the parlour were locked, they said, sure he
covereth hi feet in hi summer chamber.

3:25 and they tarri till they were ashamed: and, behold, he opened
not the door of the parlour; therefor they took a key, and opened
them: and, behold, their lord wa fallen down dead on the earth.

3:26 and ehud escap while they tarried, and pass beyond the
quarries, and escap unto seirath.

3:27 and it came to pass, when he wa come, that he blew a trumpet in
th mountain of ephraim, and the children of israel went down with him
from the mount, and he befor them.

3:28 and he said unto them, follow after me: for the lord hath
deliv your enemi the moabit into your hand. and they went down
aft him, and took the ford of jordan toward moab, and suffer not
a man to pass over.

3:29 and they slew of moab at that time about ten thousand men, all
lusty, and all men of valour; and there escap not a man.

3:30 So moab wa subdu that day under the hand of israel. and the
land had rest fourscor years.

3:31 and after him wa shamgar the son of anath, which slew of the
philistin six hundr men with an ox goad: and he also delivered
israel.

4:1 and the children of israel again did evil in the sight of the
lord, when ehud wa dead.

4:2 and the lord sold them into the hand of jabin king of canaan, that
reign in hazor; the captain of whose host wa sisera, which dwelt in
harosheth of the gentiles.

4:3 and the children of israel cri unto the lord: for he had nine
hundr chariot of iron; and twenti year he mightili oppress the
children of israel.

4:4 and deborah, a prophetess, the wife of lapidoth, she judg israel
at that time.

4:5 and she dwelt under the palm tree of deborah between ramah and
bethel in mount ephraim: and the children of israel came up to her for
judgment.

4:6 and she sent and call barak the son of abinoam out of
kedeshnaphtali, and said unto him, hath not the lord god of israel
commanded, saying, Go and draw toward mount tabor, and take with thee
ten thousand men of the children of naphtali and of the children of
zebulun?  4:7 and I will draw unto thee to the river kishon sisera,
th captain of jabin' army, with hi chariot and hi multitude; and
i will deliv him into thine hand.

4:8 and barak said unto her, If thou wilt go with me, then I will go:
but if thou wilt not go with me, then I will not go.

4:9 and she said, I will sure go with thee: notwithstand the
journey that thou takest shall not be for thine honour; for the lord
shal sell sisera into the hand of a woman. and deborah arose, and
went with barak to kedesh.

4:10 and barak call zebulun and naphtali to kedesh; and he went up
with ten thousand men at hi feet: and deborah went up with him.

4:11 now heber the kenite, which wa of the children of hobab the
fath in law of moses, had sever himself from the kenites, and
pitch hi tent unto the plain of zaanaim, which is by kedesh.

4:12 and they shew sisera that barak the son of abinoam wa gone up
to mount tabor.

4:13 and sisera gather togeth all hi chariots, even nine hundred
chariot of iron, and all the peopl that were with him, from
harosheth of the gentil unto the river of kishon.

4:14 and deborah said unto barak, up; for thi is the day in which the
lord hath deliv sisera into thine hand: is not the lord gone out
befor thee? So barak went down from mount tabor, and ten thousand men
aft him.

4:15 and the lord discomfit sisera, and all hi chariots, and all
hi host, with the edg of the sword befor barak; so that sisera
light down off hi chariot, and fled away on hi feet.

4:16 but barak pursu after the chariots, and after the host, unto
harosheth of the gentiles: and all the host of sisera fell upon the
edg of the sword; and there wa not a man left.

4:17 howbeit sisera fled away on hi feet to the tent of jael the wife
of heber the kenite: for there wa peac between jabin the king of
hazor and the hous of heber the kenite.

4:18 and jael went out to meet sisera, and said unto him, turn in, my
lord, turn in to me; fear not. and when he had turn in unto her into
th tent, she cover him with a mantle.

4:19 and he said unto her, give me, I pray thee, a littl water to
drink; for I am thirsty. and she open a bottl of milk, and gave him
drink, and cover him.

4:20 again he said unto her, stand in the door of the tent, and it
shal be, when ani man doth come and enquir of thee, and say, is
ther ani man here? that thou shalt say, no.

4:21 then jael heber' wife took a nail of the tent, and took an
hamm in her hand, and went softli unto him, and smote the nail into
hi temples, and fasten it into the ground: for he wa fast asleep
and weary. So he died.

4:22 and, behold, as barak pursu sisera, jael came out to meet him,
and said unto him, come, and I will shew thee the man whom thou
seekest. and when he came into her tent, behold, sisera lay dead, and
th nail wa in hi temples.

4:23 So god subdu on that day jabin the king of canaan befor the
children of israel.

4:24 and the hand of the children of israel prospered, and prevailed
against jabin the king of canaan, until they had destroy jabin king
of canaan.

5:1 then sang deborah and barak the son of abinoam on that day,
saying, 5:2 prais ye the lord for the aveng of israel, when the
peopl willingli offer themselves.

5:3 hear, O ye kings; give ear, O ye princes; I, even I, will sing
unto the lord; I will sing prais to the lord god of israel.

5:4 lord, when thou wentest out of seir, when thou marchedst out of
th field of edom, the earth trembled, and the heaven dropped, the
cloud also drop water.

5:5 the mountain melt from befor the lord, even that sinai from
befor the lord god of israel.

5:6 In the day of shamgar the son of anath, in the day of jael, the
highway were unoccupied, and the travel walk through byways.

5:7 the inhabit of the villag ceased, they ceas in israel,
until that I deborah arose, that I aros a mother in israel.

5:8 they chose new gods; then wa war in the gates: wa there a shield
or spear seen among forti thousand in israel?  5:9 My heart is toward
th governor of israel, that offer themselv willingli among the
people. bless ye the lord.

5:10 speak, ye that ride on white asses, ye that sit in judgment, and
walk by the way.

5:11 they that are deliv from the nois of archer in the places
of draw water, there shall they rehears the righteou act of the
lord, even the righteou act toward the inhabit of hi villages
in israel: then shall the peopl of the lord go down to the gates.

5:12 awake, awake, deborah: awake, awake, utter a song: arise, barak,
and lead thi captiv captive, thou son of abinoam.

5:13 then he made him that remaineth have dominion over the nobles
among the people: the lord made me have dominion over the mighty.

5:14 out of ephraim wa there a root of them against amalek; after
thee, benjamin, among thi people; out of machir came down governors,
and out of zebulun they that handl the pen of the writer.

5:15 and the princ of issachar were with deborah; even issachar, and
also barak: he wa sent on foot into the valley. for the divis of
reuben there were great thought of heart.

5:16 whi abodest thou among the sheepfolds, to hear the bleat of
th flocks? for the divis of reuben there were great search of
heart.

5:17 gilead abod beyond jordan: and whi did dan remain in ships?
ash continu on the sea shore, and abod in hi breaches.

5:18 zebulun and naphtali were a peopl that jeopard their lives
unto the death in the high place of the field.

5:19 the king came and fought, then fought the king of canaan in
taanach by the water of megiddo; they took no gain of money.

5:20 they fought from heaven; the star in their cours fought
against sisera.

5:21 the river of kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the
riv kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.

5:22 then were the horsehoof broken by the mean of the pransings,
th prans of their mighti ones.

5:23 curs ye meroz, said the angel of the lord, curs ye bitterli the
inhabit thereof; becaus they came not to the help of the lord, to
th help of the lord against the mighty.

5:24 bless abov women shall jael the wife of heber the kenit be,
bless shall she be abov women in the tent.

5:25 He ask water, and she gave him milk; she brought forth butter
in a lordli dish.

5:26 she put her hand to the nail, and her right hand to the workmen's
hammer; and with the hammer she smote sisera, she smote off hi head,
when she had pierc and stricken through hi temples.

5:27 At her feet he bowed, he fell, he lay down: at her feet he bowed,
h fell: where he bowed, there he fell down dead.

5:28 the mother of sisera look out at a window, and cri through
th lattice, whi is hi chariot so long in coming? whi tarri the
wheel of hi chariots?  5:29 her wise ladi answer her, yea, she
return answer to herself, 5:30 have they not sped? have they not
divid the prey; to everi man a damsel or two; to sisera a prey of
div colours, a prey of diver colour of needlework, of divers
colour of needlework on both sides, meet for the neck of them that
tak the spoil?  5:31 So let all thine enemi perish, O lord: but let
them that love him be as the sun when he goeth forth in hi might. and
th land had rest forti years.

6:1 and the children of israel did evil in the sight of the lord: and
th lord deliv them into the hand of midian seven years.

6:2 and the hand of midian prevail against israel: and becaus of
th midianit the children of israel made them the den which are in
th mountains, and caves, and strong holds.

6:3 and so it was, when israel had sown, that the midianit came up,
and the amalekites, and the children of the east, even they came up
against them; 6:4 and they encamp against them, and destroy the
increas of the earth, till thou come unto gaza, and left no
susten for israel, neither sheep, nor ox, nor ass.

6:5 for they came up with their cattl and their tents, and they came
a grasshopp for multitude; for both they and their camel were
without number: and they enter into the land to destroy it.

6:6 and israel wa greatli impoverish becaus of the midianites; and
th children of israel cri unto the lord.

6:7 and it came to pass, when the children of israel cri unto the
lord becaus of the midianites, 6:8 that the lord sent a prophet unto
th children of israel, which said unto them, thu saith the lord god
of israel, I brought you up from egypt, and brought you forth out of
th hous of bondage; 6:9 and I deliv you out of the hand of the
egyptians, and out of the hand of all that oppress you, and drave
them out from befor you, and gave you their land; 6:10 and I said
unto you, I am the lord your god; fear not the god of the amorites,
in whose land ye dwell: but ye have not obey my voice.

6:11 and there came an angel of the lord, and sat under an oak which
wa in ophrah, that pertain unto joash the abiezrite: and hi son
gideon thresh wheat by the winepress, to hide it from the
midianites.

6:12 and the angel of the lord appear unto him, and said unto him,
th lord is with thee, thou mighti man of valour.

6:13 and gideon said unto him, Oh my lord, if the lord be with us, why
then is all thi befallen us? and where be all hi miracl which our
fath told us of, saying, did not the lord bring us up from egypt?
but now the lord hath forsaken us, and deliv us into the hand of
th midianites.

6:14 and the lord look upon him, and said, Go in thi thi might, and
thou shalt save israel from the hand of the midianites: have not i
sent thee?  6:15 and he said unto him, Oh my lord, wherewith shall i
sav israel?  behold, my famili is poor in manasseh, and I am the
least in my father' house.

6:16 and the lord said unto him, sure I will be with thee, and thou
shalt smite the midianit as one man.

6:17 and he said unto him, If now I have found grace in thi sight,
then shew me a sign that thou talkest with me.

6:18 depart not hence, I pray thee, until I come unto thee, and bring
forth my present, and set it befor thee. and he said, I will tarry
until thou come again.

6:19 and gideon went in, and made readi a kid, and unleaven cake of
an ephah of flour: the flesh he put in a basket, and he put the broth
in a pot, and brought it out unto him under the oak, and present it.

6:20 and the angel of god said unto him, take the flesh and the
unleaven cakes, and lay them upon thi rock, and pour out the broth.
and he did so.

6:21 then the angel of the lord put forth the end of the staff that
wa in hi hand, and touch the flesh and the unleaven cakes; and
ther rose up fire out of the rock, and consum the flesh and the
unleaven cakes. then the angel of the lord depart out of his
sight.

6:22 and when gideon perceiv that he wa an angel of the lord,
gideon said, alas, O lord god! for becaus I have seen an angel of the
lord face to face.

6:23 and the lord said unto him, peac be unto thee; fear not: thou
shalt not die.

6:24 then gideon built an altar there unto the lord, and call it
jehovahshalom: unto thi day it is yet in ophrah of the abiezrites.

6:25 and it came to pass the same night, that the lord said unto him,
tak thi father' young bullock, even the second bullock of seven
year old, and throw down the altar of baal that thi father hath, and
cut down the grove that is by it: 6:26 and build an altar unto the
lord thi god upon the top of thi rock, in the order place, and take
th second bullock, and offer a burnt sacrific with the wood of the
grov which thou shalt cut down.

6:27 then gideon took ten men of hi servants, and did as the lord had
said unto him: and so it was, becaus he fear hi father's
household, and the men of the city, that he could not do it by day,
that he did it by night.

6:28 and when the men of the citi aros earli in the morning, behold,
th altar of baal wa cast down, and the grove wa cut down that was
bi it, and the second bullock wa offer upon the altar that was
built.

6:29 and they said one to another, who hath done thi thing? and when
they enquir and asked, they said, gideon the son of joash hath done
thi thing.

6:30 then the men of the citi said unto joash, bring out thi son, that
h may die: becaus he hath cast down the altar of baal, and because
h hath cut down the grove that wa by it.

6:31 and joash said unto all that stood against him, will ye plead for
baal? will ye save him? he that will plead for him, let him be put to
death whilst it is yet morning: if he be a god, let him plead for
himself, becaus one hath cast down hi altar.

6:32 therefor on that day he call him jerubbaal, saying, let baal
plead against him, becaus he hath thrown down hi altar.

6:33 then all the midianit and the amalekit and the children of
th east were gather together, and went over, and pitch in the
valley of jezreel.

6:34 but the spirit of the lord came upon gideon, and he blew a
trumpet; and abiez wa gather after him.

6:35 and he sent messeng throughout all manasseh; who also was
gath after him: and he sent messeng unto asher, and unto
zebulun, and unto naphtali; and they came up to meet them.

6:36 and gideon said unto god, If thou wilt save israel by mine hand,
a thou hast said, 6:37 behold, I will put a fleec of wool in the
floor; and if the dew be on the fleec only, and it be dri upon all
th earth beside, then shall I know that thou wilt save israel by mine
hand, as thou hast said.

6:38 and it wa so: for he rose up earli on the morrow, and thrust the
fleec together, and wring the dew out of the fleece, a bowl full of
water.

6:39 and gideon said unto god, let not thine anger be hot against me,
and I will speak but thi once: let me prove, I pray thee, but this
onc with the fleece; let it now be dri onli upon the fleece, and upon
al the ground let there be dew.

6:40 and god did so that night: for it wa dri upon the fleec only,
and there wa dew on all the ground.

7:1 then jerubbaal, who is gideon, and all the peopl that were with
him, rose up early, and pitch besid the well of harod: so that the
host of the midianit were on the north side of them, by the hill of
moreh, in the valley.

7:2 and the lord said unto gideon, the peopl that are with thee are
too mani for me to give the midianit into their hands, lest israel
vaunt themselv against me, saying, mine own hand hath save me.

7:3 now therefor go to, proclaim in the ear of the people, saying,
whosoev is fear and afraid, let him return and depart earli from
mount gilead. and there return of the peopl twenti and two
thousand; and there remain ten thousand.

7:4 and the lord said unto gideon, the peopl are yet too many; bring
them down unto the water, and I will tri them for thee there: and it
shal be, that of whom I say unto thee, thi shall go with thee, the
sam shall go with thee; and of whomsoev I say unto thee, thi shall
not go with thee, the same shall not go.

7:5 So he brought down the peopl unto the water: and the lord said
unto gideon, everi one that lappeth of the water with hi tongue, as a
dog lappeth, him shalt thou set by himself; likewis everi one that
boweth down upon hi knee to drink.

7:6 and the number of them that lapped, put their hand to their
mouth, were three hundr men: but all the rest of the peopl bowed
down upon their knee to drink water.

7:7 and the lord said unto gideon, By the three hundr men that
lap will I save you, and deliv the midianit into thine hand:
and let all the other peopl go everi man unto hi place.

7:8 So the peopl took victual in their hand, and their trumpets: and
h sent all the rest of israel everi man unto hi tent, and retained
thos three hundr men: and the host of midian wa beneath him in the
valley.

7:9 and it came to pass the same night, that the lord said unto him,
arise, get thee down unto the host; for I have deliv it into thine
hand.

7:10 but if thou fear to go down, go thou with phurah thi servant down
to the host: 7:11 and thou shalt hear what they say; and afterward
shal thine hand be strengthen to go down unto the host. then went
h down with phurah hi servant unto the outsid of the arm men that
wer in the host.

7:12 and the midianit and the amalekit and all the children of the
east lay along in the valley like grasshopp for multitude; and
their camel were without number, as the sand by the sea side for
multitude.

7:13 and when gideon wa come, behold, there wa a man that told a
dream unto hi fellow, and said, behold, I dream a dream, and, lo, a
cak of barley bread tumbl into the host of midian, and came unto a
tent, and smote it that it fell, and overturn it, that the tent lay
along.

7:14 and hi fellow answer and said, thi is noth els save the
sword of gideon the son of joash, a man of israel: for into hi hand
hath god deliv midian, and all the host.

7:15 and it wa so, when gideon heard the tell of the dream, and
th interpret thereof, that he worshipped, and return into the
host of israel, and said, arise; for the lord hath deliv into your
hand the host of midian.

7:16 and he divid the three hundr men into three companies, and he
put a trumpet in everi man' hand, with empti pitchers, and lamps
within the pitchers.

7:17 and he said unto them, look on me, and do likewise: and, behold,
when I come to the outsid of the camp, it shall be that, as I do, so
shal ye do.

7:18 when I blow with a trumpet, I and all that are with me, then blow
y the trumpet also on everi side of all the camp, and say, the sword
of the lord, and of gideon.

7:19 So gideon, and the hundr men that were with him, came unto the
outsid of the camp in the begin of the middl watch; and they had
but newli set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and brake the
pitch that were in their hands.

7:20 and the three compani blew the trumpets, and brake the
pitchers, and held the lamp in their left hands, and the trumpet in
their right hand to blow withal: and they cried, the sword of the
lord, and of gideon.

7:21 and they stood everi man in hi place round about the camp; and
al the host ran, and cried, and fled.

7:22 and the three hundr blew the trumpets, and the lord set every
man' sword against hi fellow, even throughout all the host: and the
host fled to bethshittah in zererath, and to the border of
abelmeholah, unto tabbath.

7:23 and the men of israel gather themselv togeth out of
naphtali, and out of asher, and out of all manasseh, and pursu after
th midianites.

7:24 and gideon sent messeng throughout all mount ephraim, saying,
com down against the midianites, and take befor them the water unto
bethbarah and jordan. then all the men of ephraim gather themselves
together, and took the water unto bethbarah and jordan.

7:25 and they took two princ of the midianites, oreb and zeeb; and
they slew oreb upon the rock oreb, and zeeb they slew at the winepress
of zeeb, and pursu midian, and brought the head of oreb and zeeb to
gideon on the other side jordan.

8:1 and the men of ephraim said unto him, whi hast thou serv us
thus, that thou calledst us not, when thou wentest to fight with the
midianites?  and they did chide with him sharply.

8:2 and he said unto them, what have I done now in comparison of you?
