i not the glean of the grape of ephraim better than the vintage
of abiezer?  8:3 god hath deliv into your hand the princ of
midian, oreb and zeeb: and what wa I abl to do in comparison of you?
then their anger wa abat toward him, when he had said that.

8:4 and gideon came to jordan, and pass over, he, and the three
hundr men that were with him, faint, yet pursu them.

8:5 and he said unto the men of succoth, give, I pray you, loav of
bread unto the peopl that follow me; for they be faint, and I am
pursu after zebah and zalmunna, king of midian.

8:6 and the princ of succoth said, are the hand of zebah and
zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thine army?
8:7 and gideon said, therefor when the lord hath deliv zebah and
zalmunna into mine hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns
of the wilder and with briers.

8:8 and he went up thenc to penuel, and spake unto them likewise: and
th men of penuel answer him as the men of succoth had answer him.

8:9 and he spake also unto the men of penuel, saying, when I come
again in peace, I will break down thi tower.

8:10 now zebah and zalmunna were in karkor, and their host with them,
about fifteen thousand men, all that were left of all the host of the
children of the east: for there fell an hundr and twenti thousand
men that drew sword.

8:11 and gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tent on the
east of nobah and jogbehah, and smote the host; for the host was
secure.

8:12 and when zebah and zalmunna fled, he pursu after them, and took
th two king of midian, zebah and zalmunna, and discomfit all the
host.

8:13 and gideon the son of joash return from battl befor the sun
wa up, 8:14 and caught a young man of the men of succoth, and
enquir of him: and he describ unto him the princ of succoth, and
th elder thereof, even threescor and seventeen men.

8:15 and he came unto the men of succoth, and said, behold zebah and
zalmunna, with whom ye did upbraid me, saying, are the hand of zebah
and zalmunna now in thine hand, that we should give bread unto thi men
that are weary?  8:16 and he took the elder of the city, and thorns
of the wilder and briers, and with them he taught the men of
succoth.

8:17 and he beat down the tower of penuel, and slew the men of the
city.

8:18 then said he unto zebah and zalmunna, what manner of men were
they whom ye slew at tabor? and they answered, As thou art, so were
they; each one resembl the children of a king.

8:19 and he said, they were my brethren, even the son of my mother:
a the lord liveth, if ye had save them alive, I would not slay you.

8:20 and he said unto jether hi firstborn, up, and slay them. but the
youth drew not hi sword: for he feared, becaus he wa yet a youth.

8:21 then zebah and zalmunna said, rise thou, and fall upon us: for as
th man is, so is hi strength. and gideon arose, and slew zebah and
zalmunna, and took away the ornament that were on their camels'
necks.

8:22 then the men of israel said unto gideon, rule thou over us, both
thou, and thi son, and thi son' son also: for thou hast deliv us
from the hand of midian.

8:23 and gideon said unto them, I will not rule over you, neither
shal my son rule over you: the lord shall rule over you.

8:24 and gideon said unto them, I would desir a request of you, that
y would give me everi man the ear of hi prey. (for they had
golden earrings, becaus they were ishmaelites.)  8:25 and they
answered, We will willingli give them. and they spread a garment, and
did cast therein everi man the ear of hi prey.

8:26 and the weight of the golden ear that he request wa a
thousand and seven hundr shekel of gold; besid ornaments, and
collars, and purpl raiment that wa on the king of midian, and
besid the chain that were about their camels' necks.

8:27 and gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in hi city, even in
ophrah: and all israel went thither a whore after it: which thing
becam a snare unto gideon, and to hi house.

8:28 thu wa midian subdu befor the children of israel, so that
they lift up their head no more. and the countri wa in quietness
forti year in the day of gideon.

8:29 and jerubba the son of joash went and dwelt in hi own house.

8:30 and gideon had threescor and ten son of hi bodi begotten: for
h had mani wives.

8:31 and hi concubin that wa in shechem, she also bare him a son,
whos name he call abimelech.

8:32 and gideon the son of joash die in a good old age, and was
buri in the sepulchr of joash hi father, in ophrah of the
abiezrites.

8:33 and it came to pass, as soon as gideon wa dead, that the
children of israel turn again, and went a whore after baalim, and
mad baalberith their god.

8:34 and the children of israel rememb not the lord their god, who
had deliv them out of the hand of all their enemi on every
side: 8:35 neither shew they kind to the hous of jerubbaal,
namely, gideon, accord to all the good which he had shew unto
israel.

9:1 and abimelech the son of jerubba went to shechem unto his
mother' brethren, and commun with them, and with all the famili of
th hous of hi mother' father, saying, 9:2 speak, I pray you, in
th ear of all the men of shechem, whether is better for you, either
that all the son of jerubbaal, which are threescor and ten persons,
reign over you, or that one reign over you? rememb also that I am
your bone and your flesh.

9:3 and hi mother' brethren spake of him in the ear of all the men
of shechem all these words: and their heart inclin to follow
abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.

9:4 and they gave him threescor and ten piec of silver out of the
hous of baalberith, wherewith abimelech hire vain and light persons,
which follow him.

9:5 and he went unto hi father' hous at ophrah, and slew his
brethren the son of jerubbaal, be threescor and ten persons, upon
on stone: notwithstand yet jotham the youngest son of jerubbaal
wa left; for he hid himself.

9:6 and all the men of shechem gather together, and all the hous of
millo, and went, and made abimelech king, by the plain of the pillar
that wa in shechem.

9:7 and when they told it to jotham, he went and stood in the top of
mount gerizim, and lift up hi voice, and cried, and said unto them,
hearken unto me, ye men of shechem, that god may hearken unto you.

9:8 the tree went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and
they said unto the oliv tree, reign thou over us.

9:9 but the oliv tree said unto them, should I leav my fatness,
wherewith by me they honour god and man, and go to be promot over
th trees?  9:10 and the tree said to the fig tree, come thou, and
reign over us.

9:11 but the fig tree said unto them, should I forsak my sweetness,
and my good fruit, and go to be promot over the trees?  9:12 then
said the tree unto the vine, come thou, and reign over us.

9:13 and the vine said unto them, should I leav my wine, which
cheereth god and man, and go to be promot over the trees?  9:14 then
said all the tree unto the bramble, come thou, and reign over us.

9:15 and the brambl said unto the trees, If in truth ye anoint me
k over you, then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not,
let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedar of lebanon.

9:16 now therefore, if ye have done truli and sincerely, in that ye
hav made abimelech king, and if ye have dealt well with jerubba and
hi house, and have done unto him accord to the deserv of his
hands; 9:17 (for my father fought for you, and adventur hi life
far, and deliv you out of the hand of midian: 9:18 and ye are
risen up against my father' hous thi day, and have slain hi sons,
threescor and ten persons, upon one stone, and have made abimelech,
th son of hi maidservant, king over the men of shechem, becaus he
i your brother;) 9:19 If ye then have dealt truli and sincer with
jerubba and with hi hous thi day, then rejoic ye in abimelech,
and let him also rejoic in you: 9:20 but if not, let fire come out
from abimelech, and devour the men of shechem, and the hous of millo;
and let fire come out from the men of shechem, and from the hous of
millo, and devour abimelech.

9:21 and jotham ran away, and fled, and went to beer, and dwelt there,
for fear of abimelech hi brother.

9:22 when abimelech had reign three year over israel, 9:23 then god
sent an evil spirit between abimelech and the men of shechem; and the
men of shechem dealt treacher with abimelech: 9:24 that the
cruelti done to the threescor and ten son of jerubba might come,
and their blood be laid upon abimelech their brother, which slew them;
and upon the men of shechem, which aid him in the kill of his
brethren.

9:25 and the men of shechem set lier in wait for him in the top of
th mountains, and they rob all that came along that way by them:
and it wa told abimelech.

9:26 and gaal the son of ebe came with hi brethren, and went over to
shechem: and the men of shechem put their confid in him.

9:27 and they went out into the fields, and gather their vineyards,
and trode the grapes, and made merry, and went into the hous of their
god, and did eat and drink, and curs abimelech.

9:28 and gaal the son of ebe said, who is abimelech, and who is
shechem, that we should serv him? is not he the son of jerubbaal? and
zebul hi officer? serv the men of hamor the father of shechem: for
whi should we serv him?  9:29 and would to god thi peopl were under
mi hand! then would I remov abimelech. and he said to abimelech,
increas thine army, and come out.

9:30 and when zebul the ruler of the citi heard the word of gaal the
son of ebed, hi anger wa kindled.

9:31 and he sent messeng unto abimelech privily, saying, behold,
ga the son of ebe and hi brethren be come to shechem; and, behold,
they fortifi the citi against thee.

9:32 now therefor up by night, thou and the peopl that is with thee,
and lie in wait in the field: 9:33 and it shall be, that in the
morning, as soon as the sun is up, thou shalt rise early, and set upon
th city: and, behold, when he and the peopl that is with him come
out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find
occasion.

9:34 and abimelech rose up, and all the peopl that were with him, by
night, and they laid wait against shechem in four companies.

9:35 and gaal the son of ebe went out, and stood in the enter of
th gate of the city: and abimelech rose up, and the peopl that were
with him, from lie in wait.

9:36 and when gaal saw the people, he said to zebul, behold, there
com peopl down from the top of the mountains. and zebul said unto
him, thou seest the shadow of the mountain as if they were men.

9:37 and gaal spake again, and said, see there come peopl down by the
middl of the land, and anoth compani come along by the plain of
meonenim.

9:38 then said zebul unto him, where is now thi mouth, wherewith thou
saidst, who is abimelech, that we should serv him? is not thi the
peopl that thou hast despised? go out, I pray now, and fight with
them.

9:39 and gaal went out befor the men of shechem, and fought with
abimelech.

9:40 and abimelech chase him, and he fled befor him, and mani were
overthrown and wounded, even unto the enter of the gate.

9:41 and abimelech dwelt at arumah: and zebul thrust out gaal and his
brethren, that they should not dwell in shechem.

9:42 and it came to pass on the morrow, that the peopl went out into
th field; and they told abimelech.

9:43 and he took the people, and divid them into three companies,
and laid wait in the field, and looked, and, behold, the peopl were
com forth out of the city; and he rose up against them, and smote
them.

9:44 and abimelech, and the compani that wa with him, rush forward,
and stood in the enter of the gate of the city: and the two other
compani ran upon all the peopl that were in the fields, and slew
them.

9:45 and abimelech fought against the citi all that day; and he took
th city, and slew the peopl that wa therein, and beat down the
city, and sow it with salt.

9:46 and when all the men of the tower of shechem heard that, they
ent into an hold of the hous of the god berith.

9:47 and it wa told abimelech, that all the men of the tower of
shechem were gather together.

9:48 and abimelech gat him up to mount zalmon, he and all the people
that were with him; and abimelech took an axe in hi hand, and cut
down a bough from the trees, and took it, and laid it on hi shoulder,
and said unto the peopl that were with him, what ye have seen me do,
mak haste, and do as I have done.

9:49 and all the peopl likewis cut down everi man hi bough, and
follow abimelech, and put them to the hold, and set the hold on fire
upon them; so that all the men of the tower of shechem die also,
about a thousand men and women.

9:50 then went abimelech to thebez, and encamp against thebez, and
took it.

9:51 but there wa a strong tower within the city, and thither fled
al the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut it to them,
and gat them up to the top of the tower.

9:52 and abimelech came unto the tower, and fought against it, and
went hard unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire.

9:53 and a certain woman cast a piec of a millston upon abimelech's
head, and all to brake hi skull.

9:54 then he call hastili unto the young man hi armourbearer, and
said unto him, draw thi sword, and slay me, that men say not of me, a
women slew him. and hi young man thrust him through, and he died.

9:55 and when the men of israel saw that abimelech wa dead, they
depart everi man unto hi place.

9:56 thu god render the wicked of abimelech, which he did unto
hi father, in slay hi seventi brethren: 9:57 and all the evil of
th men of shechem did god render upon their heads: and upon them came
th curs of jotham the son of jerubbaal.

10:1 and after abimelech there aros to defend israel tola the son of
puah, the son of dodo, a man of issachar; and he dwelt in shamir in
mount ephraim.

10:2 and he judg israel twenti and three years, and died, and was
buri in shamir.

10:3 and after him aros jair, a gileadite, and judg israel twenty
and two years.

10:4 and he had thirti son that rode on thirti ass colts, and they
had thirti cities, which are call havothjair unto thi day, which
ar in the land of gilead.

10:5 and jair died, and wa buri in camon.

10:6 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord, and serv baalim, and ashtaroth, and the god of syria, and the
god of zidon, and the god of moab, and the god of the children of
ammon, and the god of the philistines, and forsook the lord, and
serv not him.

10:7 and the anger of the lord wa hot against israel, and he sold
them into the hand of the philistines, and into the hand of the
children of ammon.

10:8 and that year they vex and oppress the children of israel:
eighteen years, all the children of israel that were on the other side
jordan in the land of the amorites, which is in gilead.

10:9 moreov the children of ammon pass over jordan to fight also
against judah, and against benjamin, and against the hous of ephraim;
so that israel wa sore distressed.

10:10 and the children of israel cri unto the lord, saying, We have
sin against thee, both becaus we have forsaken our god, and also
serv baalim.

10:11 and the lord said unto the children of israel, did not I deliver
y from the egyptians, and from the amorites, from the children of
ammon, and from the philistines?  10:12 the zidonian also, and the
amalekites, and the maonites, did oppress you; and ye cri to me, and
i deliv you out of their hand.

10:13 yet ye have forsaken me, and serv other gods: wherefor I will
deliv you no more.

10:14 Go and cri unto the god which ye have chosen; let them deliver
y in the time of your tribulation.

10:15 and the children of israel said unto the lord, We have sinned:
do thou unto us whatsoev seemeth good unto thee; deliv us only, we
pray thee, thi day.

10:16 and they put away the strang god from among them, and served
th lord: and hi soul wa griev for the miseri of israel.

10:17 then the children of ammon were gather together, and encamped
in gilead. and the children of israel assembl themselv together,
and encamp in mizpeh.

10:18 and the peopl and princ of gilead said one to another, what
man is he that will begin to fight against the children of ammon? he
shal be head over all the inhabit of gilead.

11:1 now jephthah the gileadit wa a mighti man of valour, and he was
th son of an harlot: and gilead begat jephthah.

11:2 and gilead' wife bare him sons; and hi wife' son grew up, and
they thrust out jephthah, and said unto him, thou shalt not inherit in
our father' house; for thou art the son of a strang woman.

11:3 then jephthah fled from hi brethren, and dwelt in the land of
tob: and there were gather vain men to jephthah, and went out with
him.

11:4 and it came to pass in process of time, that the children of
ammon made war against israel.

11:5 and it wa so, that when the children of ammon made war against
israel, the elder of gilead went to fetch jephthah out of the land of
tob: 11:6 and they said unto jephthah, come, and be our captain, that
w may fight with the children of ammon.

11:7 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead, did not ye hate me,
and expel me out of my father' house? and whi are ye come unto me now
when ye are in distress?  11:8 and the elder of gilead said unto
jephthah, therefor we turn again to thee now, that thou mayest go
with us, and fight against the children of ammon, and be our head over
al the inhabit of gilead.

11:9 and jephthah said unto the elder of gilead, If ye bring me home
again to fight against the children of ammon, and the lord deliver
them befor me, shall I be your head?  11:10 and the elder of gilead
said unto jephthah, the lord be wit between us, if we do not so
accord to thi words.

11:11 then jephthah went with the elder of gilead, and the people
mad him head and captain over them: and jephthah utter all his
word befor the lord in mizpeh.

11:12 and jephthah sent messeng unto the king of the children of
ammon, saying, what hast thou to do with me, that thou art come
against me to fight in my land?  11:13 and the king of the children of
ammon answer unto the messeng of jephthah, becaus israel took
away my land, when they came up out of egypt, from arnon even unto
jabbok, and unto jordan: now therefor restor those land again
peaceably.

11:14 and jephthah sent messeng again unto the king of the children
of ammon: 11:15 and said unto him, thu saith jephthah, israel took
not away the land of moab, nor the land of the children of ammon:
11:16 but when israel came up from egypt, and walk through the
wild unto the red sea, and came to kadesh; 11:17 then israel
s messeng unto the king of edom, saying, let me, I pray thee,
pass through thi land: but the king of edom would not hearken thereto.
and in like manner they sent unto the king of moab: but he would not
consent: and israel abod in kadesh.

11:18 then they went along through the wilderness, and compass the
land of edom, and the land of moab, and came by the east side of the
land of moab, and pitch on the other side of arnon, but came not
within the border of moab: for arnon wa the border of moab.

11:19 and israel sent messeng unto sihon king of the amorites, the
k of heshbon; and israel said unto him, let us pass, we pray thee,
through thi land into my place.

11:20 but sihon trust not israel to pass through hi coast: but
sihon gather all hi peopl together, and pitch in jahaz, and
fought against israel.

11:21 and the lord god of israel deliv sihon and all hi people
into the hand of israel, and they smote them: so israel possess all
th land of the amorites, the inhabit of that country.

11:22 and they possess all the coast of the amorites, from arnon
even unto jabbok, and from the wilder even unto jordan.

11:23 So now the lord god of israel hath dispossess the amorites
from befor hi peopl israel, and shouldest thou possess it?  11:24
wilt not thou possess that which chemosh thi god giveth thee to
possess? So whomsoev the lord our god shall drive out from before
us, them will we possess.

11:25 and now art thou ani thing better than balak the son of zippor,
k of moab? did he ever strive against israel, or did he ever fight
against them, 11:26 while israel dwelt in heshbon and her towns, and
in aroer and her towns, and in all the citi that be along by the
coast of arnon, three hundr years? whi therefor did ye not recover
them within that time?  11:27 wherefor I have not sin against
thee, but thou doest me wrong to war against me: the lord the judg be
judg thi day between the children of israel and the children of
ammon.

11:28 howbeit the king of the children of ammon hearken not unto the
word of jephthah which he sent him.

11:29 then the spirit of the lord came upon jephthah, and he passed
ov gilead, and manasseh, and pass over mizpeh of gilead, and from
mizpeh of gilead he pass over unto the children of ammon.

11:30 and jephthah vow a vow unto the lord, and said, If thou shalt
without fail deliv the children of ammon into mine hands, 11:31 then
it shall be, that whatsoev cometh forth of the door of my hous to
meet me, when I return in peac from the children of ammon, shall
sur be the lord's, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering.

11:32 So jephthah pass over unto the children of ammon to fight
against them; and the lord deliv them into hi hands.

11:33 and he smote them from aroer, even till thou come to minnith,
even twenti cities, and unto the plain of the vineyards, with a very
great slaughter. thu the children of ammon were subdu befor the
children of israel.

11:34 and jephthah came to mizpeh unto hi house, and, behold, his
daught came out to meet him with timbrel and with dances: and she
wa hi onli child; besid her he had neither son nor daughter.

11:35 and it came to pass, when he saw her, that he rent hi clothes,
and said, alas, my daughter! thou hast brought me veri low, and thou
art one of them that troubl me: for I have open my mouth unto the
lord, and I cannot go back.

11:36 and she said unto him, My father, if thou hast open thi mouth
unto the lord, do to me accord to that which hath proceed out of
thi mouth; forasmuch as the lord hath taken vengeanc for thee of
thin enemies, even of the children of ammon.

11:37 and she said unto her father, let thi thing be done for me: let
m alon two months, that I may go up and down upon the mountains, and
bewail my virginity, I and my fellows.

11:38 and he said, go. and he sent her away for two months: and she
went with her companions, and bewail her virgin upon the
mountains.

11:39 and it came to pass at the end of two months, that she returned
unto her father, who did with her accord to hi vow which he had
vowed: and she knew no man. and it wa a custom in israel, 11:40 that
th daughter of israel went yearli to lament the daughter of jephthah
th gileadit four day in a year.

12:1 and the men of ephraim gather themselv together, and went
northward, and said unto jephthah, wherefor passedst thou over to
fight against the children of ammon, and didst not call us to go with
thee? we will burn thine hous upon thee with fire.

12:2 and jephthah said unto them, I and my peopl were at great strife
with the children of ammon; and when I call you, ye deliv me not
out of their hands.

12:3 and when I saw that ye deliv me not, I put my life in my
hands, and pass over against the children of ammon, and the lord
deliv them into my hand: wherefor then are ye come up unto me
thi day, to fight against me?  12:4 then jephthah gather together
al the men of gilead, and fought with ephraim: and the men of gilead
smot ephraim, becaus they said, Ye gileadit are fugit of
ephraim among the ephraimites, and among the manassites.

12:5 and the gileadit took the passag of jordan befor the
ephraimites: and it wa so, that when those ephraimit which were
escap said, let me go over; that the men of gilead said unto him,
art thou an ephraimite? If he said, nay; 12:6 then said they unto him,
say now shibboleth: and he said sibboleth: for he could not frame to
pronounc it right. then they took him, and slew him at the passages
of jordan: and there fell at that time of the ephraimit forti and
two thousand.

12:7 and jephthah judg israel six years. then die jephthah the
gileadite, and wa buri in one of the citi of gilead.

12:8 and after him ibzan of bethlehem judg israel.

12:9 and he had thirti sons, and thirti daughters, whom he sent
abroad, and took in thirti daughter from abroad for hi sons. and he
judg israel seven years.

12:10 then die ibzan, and wa buri at bethlehem.

12:11 and after him elon, a zebulonite, judg israel; and he judged
israel ten years.

12:12 and elon the zebulonit died, and wa buri in aijalon in the
countri of zebulun.

12:13 and after him abdon the son of hillel, a pirathonite, judged
israel.

12:14 and he had forti son and thirti nephews, that rode on
threescor and ten ass colts: and he judg israel eight years.

12:15 and abdon the son of hillel the pirathonit died, and wa buried
in pirathon in the land of ephraim, in the mount of the amalekites.

13:1 and the children of israel did evil again in the sight of the
lord; and the lord deliv them into the hand of the philistines
forti years.

13:2 and there wa a certain man of zorah, of the famili of the
danites, whose name wa manoah; and hi wife wa barren, and bare not.

13:3 and the angel of the lord appear unto the woman, and said unto
her, behold now, thou art barren, and bearest not: but thou shalt
conceive, and bear a son.

13:4 now therefor beware, I pray thee, and drink not wine nor strong
drink, and eat not ani unclean thing: 13:5 for, lo, thou shalt
conceive, and bear a son; and no razor shall come on hi head: for the
child shall be a nazarit unto god from the womb: and he shall begin
to deliv israel out of the hand of the philistines.

13:6 then the woman came and told her husband, saying, A man of god
cam unto me, and hi counten wa like the counten of an angel
of god, veri terrible: but I ask him not whenc he was, neither told
h me hi name: 13:7 but he said unto me, behold, thou shalt conceive,
and bear a son; and now drink no wine nor strong drink, neither eat
ani unclean thing: for the child shall be a nazarit to god from the
womb to the day of hi death.

13:8 then manoah intreat the lord, and said, O my lord, let the man
of god which thou didst send come again unto us, and teach us what we
shal do unto the child that shall be born.

13:9 and god hearken to the voic of manoah; and the angel of god
cam again unto the woman as she sat in the field: but manoah her
husband wa not with her.

13:10 and the woman made haste, and ran, and shew her husband, and
said unto him, behold, the man hath appear unto me, that came unto
m the other day.

13:11 and manoah arose, and went after hi wife, and came to the man,
and said unto him, art thou the man that spakest unto the woman? and
h said, I am.

13:12 and manoah said, now let thi word come to pass. how shall we
ord the child, and how shall we do unto him?  13:13 and the angel of
th lord said unto manoah, Of all that I said unto the woman let her
beware.

13:14 she may not eat of ani thing that cometh of the vine, neither
let her drink wine or strong drink, nor eat ani unclean thing: all
that I command her let her observe.

13:15 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord, I pray thee, let us
detain thee, until we shall have made readi a kid for thee.

13:16 and the angel of the lord said unto manoah, though thou detain
me, I will not eat of thi bread: and if thou wilt offer a burnt
offering, thou must offer it unto the lord. for manoah knew not that
h wa an angel of the lord.

13:17 and manoah said unto the angel of the lord, what is thi name,
that when thi say come to pass we may do thee honour?  13:18 and
th angel of the lord said unto him, whi askest thou thu after my
name, see it is secret?  13:19 So manoah took a kid with a meat
offering, and offer it upon a rock unto the lord: and the angel did
wonderously; and manoah and hi wife look on.

13:20 for it came to pass, when the flame went up toward heaven from
off the altar, that the angel of the lord ascend in the flame of the
altar. and manoah and hi wife look on it, and fell on their faces
to the ground.

13:21 but the angel of the lord did no more appear to manoah and to
hi wife. then manoah knew that he wa an angel of the lord.

13:22 and manoah said unto hi wife, We shall sure die, becaus we
hav seen god.

13:23 but hi wife said unto him, If the lord were pleas to kill us,
h would not have receiv a burnt offer and a meat offer at our
hands, neither would he have shew us all these things, nor would as
at thi time have told us such thing as these.

13:24 and the woman bare a son, and call hi name samson: and the
child grew, and the lord bless him.

13:25 and the spirit of the lord began to move him at time in the
camp of dan between zorah and eshtaol.

14:1 and samson went down to timnath, and saw a woman in timnath of
th daughter of the philistines.

14:2 and he came up, and told hi father and hi mother, and said, i
hav seen a woman in timnath of the daughter of the philistines: now
therefor get her for me to wife.

14:3 then hi father and hi mother said unto him, Is there never a
woman among the daughter of thi brethren, or among all my people,
that thou goest to take a wife of the uncircumcis philistines? and
samson said unto hi father, get her for me; for she pleaseth me well.

14:4 but hi father and hi mother knew not that it wa of the lord,
that he sought an occas against the philistines: for at that time
th philistin had dominion over israel.

14:5 then went samson down, and hi father and hi mother, to timnath,
and came to the vineyard of timnath: and, behold, a young lion roared
against him.

14:6 and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him, and he rent
him as he would have rent a kid, and he had noth in hi hand: but
h told not hi father or hi mother what he had done.

14:7 and he went down, and talk with the woman; and she pleased
samson well.

14:8 and after a time he return to take her, and he turn asid to
se the carcas of the lion: and, behold, there wa a swarm of bees
and honey in the carcas of the lion.

14:9 and he took thereof in hi hands, and went on eating, and came to
hi father and mother, and he gave them, and they did eat: but he told
not them that he had taken the honey out of the carcas of the lion.

14:10 So hi father went down unto the woman: and samson made there a
feast; for so use the young men to do.

14:11 and it came to pass, when they saw him, that they brought thirty
companion to be with him.

14:12 and samson said unto them, I will now put forth a riddl unto
you: if ye can certainli declar it me within the seven day of the
feast, and find it out, then I will give you thirti sheet and thirty
chang of garments: 14:13 but if ye cannot declar it me, then shall
y give me thirti sheet and thirti chang of garments. and they said
unto him, put forth thi riddle, that we may hear it.

14:14 and he said unto them, out of the eater came forth meat, and out
of the strong came forth sweetness. and they could not in three days
expound the riddle.

14:15 and it came to pass on the seventh day, that they said unto
samson' wife, entic thi husband, that he may declar unto us the
riddle, lest we burn thee and thi father' hous with fire: have ye
cal us to take that we have? is it not so?  14:16 and samson' wife
wept befor him, and said, thou dost but hate me, and lovest me not:
thou hast put forth a riddl unto the children of my people, and hast
not told it me. and he said unto her, behold, I have not told it my
fath nor my mother, and shall I tell it thee?  14:17 and she wept
befor him the seven days, while their feast lasted: and it came to
pass on the seventh day, that he told her, becaus she lay sore upon
him: and she told the riddl to the children of her people.

14:18 and the men of the citi said unto him on the seventh day before
th sun went down, what is sweeter than honey? and what is stronger
than a lion?  and he said unto them, If ye had not plow with my
heifer, ye had not found out my riddle.

14:19 and the spirit of the lord came upon him, and he went down to
ashkelon, and slew thirti men of them, and took their spoil, and gave
chang of garment unto them which expound the riddle. and hi anger
wa kindled, and he went up to hi father' house.

14:20 but samson' wife wa given to hi companion, whom he had used
a hi friend.

15:1 but it came to pass within a while after, in the time of wheat
harvest, that samson visit hi wife with a kid; and he said, I will
go in to my wife into the chamber. but her father would not suffer him
to go in.

15:2 and her father said, I verili thought that thou hadst utterly
h her; therefor I gave her to thi companion: is not her younger
sist fairer than she? take her, I pray thee, instead of her.

15:3 and samson said concern them, now shall I be more blameless
than the philistines, though I do them a displeasure.

15:4 and samson went and caught three hundr foxes, and took
firebrands, and turn tail to tail, and put a firebrand in the midst
between two tails.

15:5 and when he had set the brand on fire, he let them go into the
stand corn of the philistines, and burnt up both the shocks, and
also the stand corn, with the vineyard and olives.

15:6 then the philistin said, who hath done this? and they answered,
samson, the son in law of the timnite, becaus he had taken hi wife,
and given her to hi companion. and the philistin came up, and burnt
her and her father with fire.

15:7 and samson said unto them, though ye have done this, yet will i
b aveng of you, and after that I will cease.

15:8 and he smote them hip and thigh with a great slaughter: and he
went down and dwelt in the top of the rock etam.

15:9 then the philistin went up, and pitch in judah, and spread
themselv in lehi.

15:10 and the men of judah said, whi are ye come up against us? and
they answered, To bind samson are we come up, to do to him as he hath
don to us.

15:11 then three thousand men of judah went to the top of the rock
etam, and said to samson, knowest thou not that the philistin are
rul over us? what is thi that thou hast done unto us? and he said
unto them, As they did unto me, so have I done unto them.

15:12 and they said unto him, We are come down to bind thee, that we
may deliv thee into the hand of the philistines. and samson said
unto them, swear unto me, that ye will not fall upon me yourselves.

15:13 and they spake unto him, saying, no; but we will bind thee fast,
and deliv thee into their hand: but sure we will not kill thee.
and they bound him with two new cords, and brought him up from the
rock.

15:14 and when he came unto lehi, the philistin shout against him:
and the spirit of the lord came mightili upon him, and the cord that
wer upon hi arm becam as flax that wa burnt with fire, and his
band loos from off hi hands.

15:15 and he found a new jawbon of an ass, and put forth hi hand,
and took it, and slew a thousand men therewith.

15:16 and samson said, with the jawbon of an ass, heap upon heaps,
with the jaw of an ass have I slain a thousand men.

15:17 and it came to pass, when he had made an end of speaking, that
h cast away the jawbon out of hi hand, and call that place
ramathlehi.

15:18 and he wa sore athirst, and call on the lord, and said, thou
hast given thi great deliver into the hand of thi servant: and
now shall I die for thirst, and fall into the hand of the
uncircumcised?  15:19 but god clave an hollow place that wa in the
jaw, and there came water thereout; and when he had drunk, hi spirit
cam again, and he revived: wherefor he call the name thereof
enhakkore, which is in lehi unto thi day.

15:20 and he judg israel in the day of the philistin twenty
years.

16:1 then went samson to gaza, and saw there an harlot, and went in
unto her.

16:2 and it wa told the gazites, saying, samson is come hither. and
they compass him in, and laid wait for him all night in the gate of
th city, and were quiet all the night, saying, In the morning, when
it is day, we shall kill him.

16:3 and samson lay till midnight, and aros at midnight, and took the
door of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and went away with
them, bar and all, and put them upon hi shoulders, and carri them
up to the top of an hill that is befor hebron.

16:4 and it came to pass afterward, that he love a woman in the
valley of sorek, whose name wa delilah.

16:5 and the lord of the philistin came up unto her, and said unto
her, entic him, and see wherein hi great strength lieth, and by what
mean we may prevail against him, that we may bind him to afflict him;
and we will give thee everi one of us eleven hundr piec of silver.

16:6 and delilah said to samson, tell me, I pray thee, wherein thy
great strength lieth, and wherewith thou mightest be bound to afflict
thee.

16:7 and samson said unto her, If they bind me with seven green withs
that were never dried, then shall I be weak, and be as anoth man.

16:8 then the lord of the philistin brought up to her seven green
with which had not been dried, and she bound him with them.

16:9 now there were men lie in wait, abid with her in the
chamber.

and she said unto him, the philistin be upon thee, samson. and he
brak the withs, as a thread of tow is broken when it toucheth the
fire. So hi strength wa not known.

16:10 and delilah said unto samson, behold, thou hast mock me, and
told me lies: now tell me, I pray thee, wherewith thou mightest be
bound.

16:11 and he said unto her, If they bind me fast with new rope that
nev were occupied, then shall I be weak, and be as anoth man.

16:12 delilah therefor took new ropes, and bound him therewith, and
said unto him, the philistin be upon thee, samson. and there were
li in wait abid in the chamber. and he brake them from off his
arm like a thread.

16:13 and delilah said unto samson, hitherto thou hast mock me, and
told me lies: tell me wherewith thou mightest be bound. and he said
unto her, If thou weavest the seven lock of my head with the web.

16:14 and she fasten it with the pin, and said unto him, the
philistin be upon thee, samson. and he awak out of hi sleep, and
went away with the pin of the beam, and with the web.

16:15 and she said unto him, how canst thou say, I love thee, when
thin heart is not with me? thou hast mock me these three times, and
hast not told me wherein thi great strength lieth.

16:16 and it came to pass, when she press him daili with her words,
and urg him, so that hi soul wa vex unto death; 16:17 that he
told her all hi heart, and said unto her, there hath not come a razor
upon mine head; for I have been a nazarit unto god from my mother's
womb: if I be shaven, then my strength will go from me, and I shall
becom weak, and be like ani other man.

16:18 and when delilah saw that he had told her all hi heart, she
sent and call for the lord of the philistines, saying, come up this
once, for he hath shew me all hi heart. then the lord of the
philistin came up unto her, and brought money in their hand.

16:19 and she made him sleep upon her knees; and she call for a man,
and she caus him to shave off the seven lock of hi head; and she
began to afflict him, and hi strength went from him.

16:20 and she said, the philistin be upon thee, samson. and he awoke
out of hi sleep, and said, I will go out as at other time before,
and shake myself. and he wist not that the lord wa depart from him.

16:21 but the philistin took him, and put out hi eyes, and brought
him down to gaza, and bound him with fetter of brass; and he did
grind in the prison house.

16:22 howbeit the hair of hi head began to grow again after he was
shaven.

16:23 then the lord of the philistin gather them togeth for to
off a great sacrific unto dagon their god, and to rejoice: for they
said, our god hath deliv samson our enemi into our hand.

16:24 and when the peopl saw him, they prais their god: for they
said, our god hath deliv into our hand our enemy, and the
destroy of our country, which slew mani of us.

16:25 and it came to pass, when their heart were merry, that they
said, call for samson, that he may make us sport. and they call for
samson out of the prison house; and he made them sport: and they set
him between the pillars.

16:26 and samson said unto the lad that held him by the hand, suffer
m that I may feel the pillar whereupon the hous standeth, that i
may lean upon them.

16:27 now the hous wa full of men and women; and all the lord of
th philistin were there; and there were upon the roof about three
thousand men and women, that beheld while samson made sport.

16:28 and samson call unto the lord, and said, O lord god, remember
me, I pray thee, and strengthen me, I pray thee, onli thi once, o
god, that I may be at onc aveng of the philistin for my two eyes.

16:29 and samson took hold of the two middl pillar upon which the
hous stood, and on which it wa born up, of the one with hi right
hand, and of the other with hi left.

16:30 and samson said, let me die with the philistines. and he bowed
himself with all hi might; and the hous fell upon the lords, and
upon all the peopl that were therein. So the dead which he slew at
hi death were more than they which he slew in hi life.

16:31 then hi brethren and all the hous of hi father came down, and
took him, and brought him up, and buri him between zorah and eshtaol
in the buryingplac of manoah hi father. and he judg israel twenty
years.

17:1 and there wa a man of mount ephraim, whose name wa micah.

17:2 and he said unto hi mother, the eleven hundr shekel of silver
that were taken from thee, about which thou cursedst, and spakest of
also in mine ears, behold, the silver is with me; I took it. and his
moth said, bless be thou of the lord, my son.

17:3 and when he had restor the eleven hundr shekel of silver to
hi mother, hi mother said, I had wholli dedic the silver unto
th lord from my hand for my son, to make a graven imag and a molten
image: now therefor I will restor it unto thee.

17:4 yet he restor the money unto hi mother; and hi mother took
two hundr shekel of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made
thereof a graven imag and a molten image: and they were in the house
of micah.

17:5 and the man micah had an hous of gods, and made an ephod, and
teraphim, and consecr one of hi sons, who becam hi priest.

17:6 In those day there wa no king in israel, but everi man did that
which wa right in hi own eyes.

17:7 and there wa a young man out of bethlehemjudah of the famili of
judah, who wa a levite, and he sojourn there.

17:8 and the man depart out of the citi from bethlehemjudah to
sojourn where he could find a place: and he came to mount ephraim to
th hous of micah, as he journeyed.

17:9 and micah said unto him, whenc comest thou? and he said unto
him, I am a levit of bethlehemjudah, and I go to sojourn where I may
find a place.

17:10 and micah said unto him, dwell with me, and be unto me a father
and a priest, and I will give thee ten shekel of silver by the year,
and a suit of apparel, and thi victuals. So the levit went in.

17:11 and the levit wa content to dwell with the man; and the young
man wa unto him as one of hi sons.

17:12 and micah consecr the levite; and the young man becam his
priest, and wa in the hous of micah.

17:13 then said micah, now know I that the lord will do me good,
se I have a levit to my priest.

18:1 In those day there wa no king in israel: and in those day the
trib of the danit sought them an inherit to dwell in; for unto
that day all their inherit had not fallen unto them among the
trib of israel.

18:2 and the children of dan sent of their famili five men from their
coasts, men of valour, from zorah, and from eshtaol, to spi out the
land, and to search it; and they said unto them, go, search the land:
who when they came to mount ephraim, to the hous of micah, they
lodg there.

18:3 when they were by the hous of micah, they knew the voic of the
young man the levite: and they turn in thither, and said unto him,
who brought thee hither? and what makest thou in thi place? and what
hast thou here?  18:4 and he said unto them, thu and thu dealeth
micah with me, and hath hire me, and I am hi priest.

18:5 and they said unto him, ask counsel, we pray thee, of god, that
w may know whether our way which we go shall be prosperous.

18:6 and the priest said unto them, Go in peace: befor the lord is
your way wherein ye go.

18:7 then the five men departed, and came to laish, and saw the people
that were therein, how they dwelt careless, after the manner of the
zidonians, quiet and secure; and there wa no magistr in the land,
that might put them to shame in ani thing; and they were far from the
zidonians, and had no busi with ani man.

18:8 and they came unto their brethren to zorah and eshtaol: and their
brethren said unto them, what say ye?  18:9 and they said, arise, that
w may go up against them: for we have seen the land, and, behold, it
i veri good: and are ye still? be not sloth to go, and to enter to
possess the land.

18:10 when ye go, ye shall come unto a peopl secure, and to a large
land: for god hath given it into your hands; a place where there is no
want of ani thing that is in the earth.

18:11 and there went from thenc of the famili of the danites, out of
zorah and out of eshtaol, six hundr men appoint with weapon of
war.

18:12 and they went up, and pitch in kirjathjearim, in judah:
wherefor they call that place mahanehdan unto thi day: behold, it
i behind kirjathjearim.

18:13 and they pass thenc unto mount ephraim, and came unto the
hous of micah.

18:14 then answer the five men that went to spi out the countri of
laish, and said unto their brethren, Do ye know that there is in these
hous an ephod, and teraphim, and a graven image, and a molten image?
now therefor consid what ye have to do.

18:15 and they turn thitherward, and came to the hous of the young
man the levite, even unto the hous of micah, and salut him.

18:16 and the six hundr men appoint with their weapon of war,
which were of the children of dan, stood by the enter of the gate.

18:17 and the five men that went to spi out the land went up, and came
in thither, and took the graven image, and the ephod, and the
teraphim, and the molten image: and the priest stood in the entering
of the gate with the six hundr men that were appoint with weapons
of war.

18:18 and these went into micah' house, and fetch the carv image,
th ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image. then said the
priest unto them, what do ye?  18:19 and they said unto him, hold thy
peace, lay thine hand upon thi mouth, and go with us, and be to us a
fath and a priest: is it better for thee to be a priest unto the
hous of one man, or that thou be a priest unto a tribe and a family
in israel?  18:20 and the priest' heart wa glad, and he took the
ephod, and the teraphim, and the graven image, and went in the midst
of the people.

18:21 So they turn and departed, and put the littl one and the
cattl and the carriag befor them.

18:22 and when they were a good way from the hous of micah, the men
that were in the hous near to micah' hous were gather together,
and overtook the children of dan.

18:23 and they cri unto the children of dan. and they turn their
faces, and said unto micah, what aileth thee, that thou comest with
such a company?  18:24 and he said, Ye have taken away my god which i
made, and the priest, and ye are gone away: and what have I more? and
what is thi that ye say unto me, what aileth thee?  18:25 and the
children of dan said unto him, let not thi voic be heard among us,
lest angri fellow run upon thee, and thou lose thi life, with the
liv of thi household.

18:26 and the children of dan went their way: and when micah saw that
they were too strong for him, he turn and went back unto hi house.

18:27 and they took the thing which micah had made, and the priest
which he had, and came unto laish, unto a peopl that were at quiet
and secure: and they smote them with the edg of the sword, and burnt
th citi with fire.

18:28 and there wa no deliverer, becaus it wa far from zidon, and
they had no busi with ani man; and it wa in the valley that lieth
bi bethrehob. and they built a city, and dwelt therein.

18:29 and they call the name of the citi dan, after the name of dan
their father, who wa born unto israel: howbeit the name of the city
wa laish at the first.

18:30 and the children of dan set up the graven image: and jonathan,
th son of gershom, the son of manasseh, he and hi son were priests
to the tribe of dan until the day of the captiv of the land.

18:31 and they set them up micah' graven image, which he made, all
th time that the hous of god wa in shiloh.

19:1 and it came to pass in those days, when there wa no king in
israel, that there wa a certain levit sojourn on the side of
mount ephraim, who took to him a concubin out of bethlehemjudah.

19:2 and hi concubin play the whore against him, and went away
from him unto her father' hous to bethlehemjudah, and wa there four
whol months.

19:3 and her husband arose, and went after her, to speak friendli unto
her, and to bring her again, have hi servant with him, and a couple
of asses: and she brought him into her father' house: and when the
fath of the damsel saw him, he rejoic to meet him.

19:4 and hi father in law, the damsel' father, retain him; and he
abod with him three days: so they did eat and drink, and lodged
there.

19:5 and it came to pass on the fourth day, when they aros earli in
th morning, that he rose up to depart: and the damsel' father said
unto hi son in law, comfort thine heart with a morsel of bread, and
afterward go your way.

19:6 and they sat down, and did eat and drink both of them together:
for the damsel' father had said unto the man, Be content, I pray
thee, and tarri all night, and let thine heart be merry.

19:7 and when the man rose up to depart, hi father in law urg him:
therefor he lodg there again.

19:8 and he aros earli in the morn on the fifth day to depart; and
th damsel' father said, comfort thine heart, I pray thee. and they
tarri until afternoon, and they did eat both of them.

19:9 and when the man rose up to depart, he, and hi concubine, and
hi servant, hi father in law, the damsel' father, said unto him,
behold, now the day draweth toward evening, I pray you tarri all
night: behold, the day groweth to an end, lodg here, that thine heart
may be merry; and to morrow get you earli on your way, that thou
mayest go home.

19:10 but the man would not tarri that night, but he rose up and
departed, and came over against jebus, which is jerusalem; and there
wer with him two ass saddled, hi concubin also wa with him.

19:11 and when they were by jebus, the day wa far spent; and the
serv said unto hi master, come, I pray thee, and let us turn in
into thi citi of the jebusites, and lodg in it.

19:12 and hi master said unto him, We will not turn asid hither into
th citi of a stranger, that is not of the children of israel; we will
pass over to gibeah.

19:13 and he said unto hi servant, come, and let us draw near to one
of these place to lodg all night, in gibeah, or in ramah.

19:14 and they pass on and went their way; and the sun went down
upon them when they were by gibeah, which belongeth to benjamin.

19:15 and they turn asid thither, to go in and to lodg in gibeah:
and when he went in, he sat him down in a street of the city: for
ther wa no man that took them into hi hous to lodging.

19:16 and, behold, there came an old man from hi work out of the
field at even, which wa also of mount ephraim; and he sojourn in
gibeah: but the men of the place were benjamites.

19:17 and when he had lift up hi eyes, he saw a wayfar man in
th street of the city: and the old man said, whither goest thou? and
whenc comest thou?  19:18 and he said unto him, We are pass from
bethlehemjudah toward the side of mount ephraim; from thenc am I: and
i went to bethlehemjudah, but I am now go to the hous of the lord;
and there is no man that receiveth me to house.

19:19 yet there is both straw and provend for our asses; and there
i bread and wine also for me, and for thi handmaid, and for the young
man which is with thi servants: there is no want of ani thing.

19:20 and the old man said, peac be with thee; howsoev let all thy
want lie upon me; onli lodg not in the street.

19:21 So he brought him into hi house, and gave provend unto the
asses: and they wash their feet, and did eat and drink.

19:22 now as they were make their heart merry, behold, the men of
th city, certain son of belial, beset the hous round about, and
beat at the door, and spake to the master of the house, the old man,
saying, bring forth the man that came into thine house, that we may
know him.

19:23 and the man, the master of the house, went out unto them, and
said unto them, nay, my brethren, nay, I pray you, do not so wickedly;
se that thi man is come into mine house, do not thi folly.

19:24 behold, here is my daughter a maiden, and hi concubine; them i
wil bring out now, and humbl ye them, and do with them what seemeth
good unto you: but unto thi man do not so vile a thing.

19:25 but the men would not hearken to him: so the man took his
concubine, and brought her forth unto them; and they knew her, and
abus her all the night until the morning: and when the day began to
spring, they let her go.

19:26 then came the woman in the dawn of the day, and fell down at
th door of the man' hous where her lord was, till it wa light.

19:27 and her lord rose up in the morning, and open the door of the
house, and went out to go hi way: and, behold, the woman his
concubin wa fallen down at the door of the house, and her hand were
upon the threshold.

19:28 and he said unto her, up, and let us be going. but none
answered.

then the man took her up upon an ass, and the man rose up, and gat him
unto hi place.

19:29 and when he wa come into hi house, he took a knife, and laid
hold on hi concubine, and divid her, togeth with her bones, into
twelv pieces, and sent her into all the coast of israel.

19:30 and it wa so, that all that saw it said, there wa no such deed
don nor seen from the day that the children of israel came up out of
th land of egypt unto thi day: consid of it, take advice, and
speak your minds.

20:1 then all the children of israel went out, and the congregation
wa gather togeth as one man, from dan even to beersheba, with the
land of gilead, unto the lord in mizpeh.

20:2 and the chief of all the people, even of all the tribe of
israel, present themselv in the assembl of the peopl of god,
four hundr thousand footmen that drew sword.

20:3 (now the children of benjamin heard that the children of israel
wer gone up to mizpeh.) then said the children of israel, tell us,
how wa thi wickedness?  20:4 and the levite, the husband of the
woman that wa slain, answer and said, I came into gibeah that
belongeth to benjamin, I and my concubine, to lodge.

20:5 and the men of gibeah rose against me, and beset the hous round
about upon me by night, and thought to have slain me: and my concubine
hav they forced, that she is dead.

20:6 and I took my concubine, and cut her in pieces, and sent her
throughout all the countri of the inherit of israel: for they have
commit lewd and folli in israel.

20:7 behold, ye are all children of israel; give here your advic and
counsel.

20:8 and all the peopl aros as one man, saying, We will not ani of
u go to hi tent, neither will we ani of us turn into hi house.

20:9 but now thi shall be the thing which we will do to gibeah; we
wil go up by lot against it; 20:10 and we will take ten men of an
hundr throughout all the tribe of israel, and an hundr of a
thousand, and a thousand out of ten thousand, to fetch victual for the
people, that they may do, when they come to gibeah of benjamin,
accord to all the folli that they have wrought in israel.

20:11 So all the men of israel were gather against the city, knit
togeth as one man.

20:12 and the tribe of israel sent men through all the tribe of
benjamin, saying, what wicked is thi that is done among you?
20:13 now therefor deliv us the men, the children of belial, which
ar in gibeah, that we may put them to death, and put away evil from
israel. but the children of benjamin would not hearken to the voic of
their brethren the children of israel.

20:14 but the children of benjamin gather themselv togeth out of
th citi unto gibeah, to go out to battl against the children of
israel.

20:15 and the children of benjamin were number at that time out of
th citi twenti and six thousand men that drew sword, besid the
inhabit of gibeah, which were number seven hundr chosen men.

20:16 among all thi peopl there were seven hundr chosen men
lefthanded; everi one could sling stone at an hair breadth, and not
miss.

20:17 and the men of israel, besid benjamin, were number four
hundr thousand men that drew sword: all these were men of war.

20:18 and the children of israel arose, and went up to the hous of
god, and ask counsel of god, and said, which of us shall go up first
to the battl against the children of benjamin? and the lord said,
judah shall go up first.

20:19 and the children of israel rose up in the morning, and encamped
against gibeah.

20:20 and the men of israel went out to battl against benjamin; and
th men of israel put themselv in array to fight against them at
gibeah.

20:21 and the children of benjamin came forth out of gibeah, and
destroy down to the ground of the israelit that day twenti and two
thousand men.

20:22 and the peopl the men of israel encourag themselves, and set
their battl again in array in the place where they put themselv in
array the first day.

20:23 (and the children of israel went up and wept befor the lord
until even, and ask counsel of the lord, saying, shall I go up again
to battl against the children of benjamin my brother? and the lord
said, Go up against him.)  20:24 and the children of israel came near
against the children of benjamin the second day.

20:25 and benjamin went forth against them out of gibeah the second
day, and destroy down to the ground of the children of israel again
eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.

20:26 then all the children of israel, and all the people, went up,
and came unto the hous of god, and wept, and sat there befor the
lord, and fast that day until even, and offer burnt offer and
peac offer befor the lord.

20:27 and the children of israel enquir of the lord, (for the ark of
th coven of god wa there in those days, 20:28 and phinehas, the
son of eleazar, the son of aaron, stood befor it in those days,)
saying, shall I yet again go out to battl against the children of
benjamin my brother, or shall I cease? and the lord said, Go up; for
to morrow I will deliv them into thine hand.

20:29 and israel set lier in wait round about gibeah.

20:30 and the children of israel went up against the children of
benjamin on the third day, and put themselv in array against gibeah,
a at other times.

20:31 and the children of benjamin went out against the people, and
wer drawn away from the city; and they began to smite of the people,
and kill, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goeth up to
th hous of god, and the other to gibeah in the field, about thirty
men of israel.

20:32 and the children of benjamin said, they are smitten down before
us, as at the first. but the children of israel said, let us flee, and
draw them from the citi unto the highways.

20:33 and all the men of israel rose up out of their place, and put
themselv in array at baaltamar: and the lier in wait of israel came
forth out of their places, even out of the meadow of gibeah.

20:34 and there came against gibeah ten thousand chosen men out of all
israel, and the battl wa sore: but they knew not that evil wa near
them.

20:35 and the lord smote benjamin befor israel: and the children of
israel destroy of the benjamit that day twenti and five thousand
and an hundr men: all these drew the sword.

20:36 So the children of benjamin saw that they were smitten: for the
men of israel gave place to the benjamites, becaus they trust unto
th lier in wait which they had set besid gibeah.

20:37 and the lier in wait hasted, and rush upon gibeah; and the
lier in wait drew themselv along, and smote all the citi with the
edg of the sword.

20:38 now there wa an appoint sign between the men of israel and
th lier in wait, that they should make a great flame with smoke rise
up out of the city.

20:39 and when the men of israel retir in the battle, benjamin began
to smite and kill of the men of israel about thirti persons: for they
said, sure they are smitten down befor us, as in the first battle.

20:40 but when the flame began to aris up out of the citi with a
pillar of smoke, the benjamit look behind them, and, behold, the
flam of the citi ascend up to heaven.

20:41 and when the men of israel turn again, the men of benjamin
wer amazed: for they saw that evil wa come upon them.

20:42 therefor they turn their back befor the men of israel unto
th way of the wilderness; but the battl overtook them; and them
which came out of the citi they destroy in the midst of them.

20:43 thu they inclos the benjamit round about, and chase them,
and trode them down with eas over against gibeah toward the
sunrising.

20:44 and there fell of benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were
men of valour.

20:45 and they turn and fled toward the wilder unto the rock of
rimmon: and they glean of them in the highway five thousand men;
and pursu hard after them unto gidom, and slew two thousand men of
them.

20:46 So that all which fell that day of benjamin were twenti and five
thousand men that drew the sword; all these were men of valour.

20:47 but six hundr men turn and fled to the wilder unto the
rock rimmon, and abod in the rock rimmon four months.

20:48 and the men of israel turn again upon the children of
benjamin, and smote them with the edg of the sword, as well the men
of everi city, as the beast, and all that came to hand: also they set
on fire all the citi that they came to.

21:1 now the men of israel had sworn in mizpeh, saying, there shall
not ani of us give hi daughter unto benjamin to wife.

21:2 and the peopl came to the hous of god, and abod there till
even befor god, and lift up their voices, and wept sore; 21:3 and
said, O lord god of israel, whi is thi come to pass in israel, that
ther should be to day one tribe lack in israel?  21:4 and it came
to pass on the morrow, that the peopl rose early, and built there an
altar, and offer burnt offer and peac offerings.

21:5 and the children of israel said, who is there among all the
trib of israel that came not up with the congreg unto the lord?
for they had made a great oath concern him that came not up to the
lord to mizpeh, saying, He shall sure be put to death.

21:6 and the children of israel repent them for benjamin their
brother, and said, there is one tribe cut off from israel thi day.

21:7 how shall we do for wive for them that remain, see we have
sworn by the lord that we will not give them of our daughter to
wives?  21:8 and they said, what one is there of the tribe of israel
that came not up to mizpeh to the lord? and, behold, there came none
to the camp from jabeshgilead to the assembly.

21:9 for the peopl were numbered, and, behold, there were none of the
inhabit of jabeshgilead there.

21:10 and the congreg sent thither twelv thousand men of the
valiantest, and command them, saying, Go and smite the inhabitants
of jabeshgilead with the edg of the sword, with the women and the
children.

21:11 and thi is the thing that ye shall do, Ye shall utterli destroy
everi male, and everi woman that hath lain by man.

21:12 and they found among the inhabit of jabeshgilead four
hundr young virgins, that had known no man by lie with ani male:
and they brought them unto the camp to shiloh, which is in the land of
canaan.

21:13 and the whole congreg sent some to speak to the children of
benjamin that were in the rock rimmon, and to call peaceabl unto
them.

21:14 and benjamin came again at that time; and they gave them wives
which they had save aliv of the women of jabeshgilead: and yet so
they suffic them not.

21:15 and the peopl repent them for benjamin, becaus that the lord
had made a breach in the tribe of israel.

21:16 then the elder of the congreg said, how shall we do for
wiv for them that remain, see the women are destroy out of
benjamin?  21:17 and they said, there must be an inherit for them
that be escap of benjamin, that a tribe be not destroy out of
israel.

21:18 howbeit we may not give them wive of our daughters: for the
children of israel have sworn, saying, curs be he that giveth a wife
to benjamin.

21:19 then they said, behold, there is a feast of the lord in shiloh
yearli in a place which is on the north side of bethel, on the east
sid of the highway that goeth up from bethel to shechem, and on the
south of lebonah.

21:20 therefor they command the children of benjamin, saying, go
and lie in wait in the vineyards; 21:21 and see, and, behold, if the
daught of shiloh come out to danc in dances, then come ye out of
th vineyards, and catch you everi man hi wife of the daughter of
shiloh, and go to the land of benjamin.

21:22 and it shall be, when their father or their brethren come unto
u to complain, that we will say unto them, Be favour unto them
for our sakes: becaus we reserv not to each man hi wife in the
war: for ye did not give unto them at thi time, that ye should be
guilty.

21:23 and the children of benjamin did so, and took them wives,
accord to their number, of them that danced, whom they caught: and
they went and return unto their inheritance, and repair the
cities, and dwelt in them.

21:24 and the children of israel depart thenc at that time, every
man to hi tribe and to hi family, and they went out from thence
everi man to hi inheritance.

21:25 In those day there wa no king in israel: everi man did that
which wa right in hi own eyes.




th book of ruth


1:1 now it came to pass in the day when the judg ruled, that there
wa a famin in the land. and a certain man of bethlehemjudah went to
sojourn in the countri of moab, he, and hi wife, and hi two sons.

1:2 and the name of the man wa elimelech, and the name of hi wife
naomi, and the name of hi two son mahlon and chilion, ephrathit of
bethlehemjudah. and they came into the countri of moab, and continued
there.

1:3 and elimelech naomi' husband died; and she wa left, and her two
sons.

1:4 and they took them wive of the women of moab; the name of the one
wa orpah, and the name of the other ruth: and they dwell there
about ten years.

1:5 and mahlon and chilion die also both of them; and the woman was
left of her two son and her husband.

1:6 then she aros with her daughter in law, that she might return
from the countri of moab: for she had heard in the countri of moab how
that the lord had visit hi peopl in give them bread.

1:7 wherefor she went forth out of the place where she was, and her
two daughter in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto
th land of judah.

1:8 and naomi said unto her two daughter in law, go, return each to
her mother' house: the lord deal kindli with you, as ye have dealt
with the dead, and with me.

1:9 the lord grant you that ye may find rest, each of you in the house
of her husband. then she kiss them; and they lift up their voice,
and wept.

1:10 and they said unto her, sure we will return with thee unto thy
people.

1:11 and naomi said, turn again, my daughters: whi will ye go with me?
ar there yet ani more son in my womb, that they may be your
husbands?  1:12 turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too
old to have an husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should have
an husband also to night, and should also bear sons; 1:13 would ye
tarri for them till they were grown? would ye stay for them from
hav husbands? nay, my daughters; for it grieveth me much for your
sak that the hand of the lord is gone out against me.

1:14 and they lift up their voice, and wept again: and orpah kissed
h mother in law; but ruth clave unto her.

1:15 and she said, behold, thi sister in law is gone back unto her
people, and unto her gods: return thou after thi sister in law.

1:16 and ruth said, intreat me not to leav thee, or to return from
follow after thee: for whither thou goest, I will go; and where
th lodgest, I will lodge: thi peopl shall be my people, and thi god
mi god: 1:17 where thou diest, will I die, and there will I be buried:
th lord do so to me, and more also, if ought but death part thee and
me.

1:18 when she saw that she wa stedfastli mind to go with her, then
sh left speak unto her.

1:19 So they two went until they came to bethlehem. and it came to
pass, when they were come to bethlehem, that all the citi wa moved
about them, and they said, Is thi naomi?  1:20 and she said unto
them, call me not naomi, call me mara: for the almighti hath dealt
veri bitterli with me.

1:21 I went out full and the lord hath brought me home again empty:
whi then call ye me naomi, see the lord hath testifi against me,
and the almighti hath afflict me?  1:22 So naomi returned, and ruth
th moabitess, her daughter in law, with her, which return out of
th countri of moab: and they came to bethlehem in the begin of
barley harvest.

2:1 and naomi had a kinsman of her husband's, a mighti man of wealth,
of the famili of elimelech; and hi name wa boaz.

2:2 and ruth the moabitess said unto naomi, let me now go to the
field, and glean ear of corn after him in whose sight I shall find
grace.

and she said unto her, go, my daughter.

2:3 and she went, and came, and glean in the field after the
reapers: and her hap wa to light on a part of the field belonging
unto boaz, who wa of the kindr of elimelech.

2:4 and, behold, boaz came from bethlehem, and said unto the reapers,
th lord be with you. and they answer him, the lord bless thee.

2:5 then said boaz unto hi servant that wa set over the reapers,
whos damsel is this?  2:6 and the servant that wa set over the
reap answer and said, It is the moabitish damsel that came back
with naomi out of the countri of moab: 2:7 and she said, I pray you,
let me glean and gather after the reaper among the sheaves: so she
came, and hath continu even from the morn until now, that she
tarri a littl in the house.

2:8 then said boaz unto ruth, hearest thou not, my daughter? Go not to
glean in anoth field, neither go from hence, but abid here fast by
mi maidens: 2:9 let thine eye be on the field that they do reap, and
go thou after them: have I not charg the young men that they shall
not touch thee? and when thou art athirst, go unto the vessels, and
drink of that which the young men have drawn.

2:10 then she fell on her face, and bow herself to the ground, and
said unto him, whi have I found grace in thine eyes, that thou
shouldest take knowledg of me, see I am a stranger?  2:11 and boaz
answ and said unto her, It hath fulli been shew me, all that
thou hast done unto thi mother in law sinc the death of thine
husband: and how thou hast left thi father and thi mother, and the
land of thi nativity, and art come unto a peopl which thou knewest
not heretofore.

2:12 the lord recompens thi work, and a full reward be given thee of
th lord god of israel, under whose wing thou art come to trust.

2:13 then she said, let me find favour in thi sight, my lord; for that
thou hast comfort me, and for that thou hast spoken friendli unto
thin handmaid, though I be not like unto one of thine handmaidens.

2:14 and boaz said unto her, At mealtim come thou hither, and eat of
th bread, and dip thi morsel in the vinegar. and she sat besid the
reapers: and he reach her parch corn, and she did eat, and was
sufficed, and left.

2:15 and when she wa risen up to glean, boaz command hi young men,
saying, let her glean even among the sheaves, and reproach her not:
2:16 and let fall also some of the hand of purpos for her, and
leav them, that she may glean them, and rebuk her not.

2:17 So she glean in the field until even, and beat out that she had
gleaned: and it wa about an ephah of barley.

2:18 and she took it up, and went into the city: and her mother in law
saw what she had gleaned: and she brought forth, and gave to her that
sh had reserv after she wa sufficed.

2:19 and her mother in law said unto her, where hast thou glean to
day?  and where wroughtest thou? bless be he that did take knowledge
of thee. and she shew her mother in law with whom she had wrought,
and said, the man' name with whom I wrought to day is boaz.

2:20 and naomi said unto her daughter in law, bless be he of the
lord, who hath not left off hi kind to the live and to the
dead. and naomi said unto her, the man is near of kin unto us, one of
our next kinsmen.

2:21 and ruth the moabitess said, He said unto me also, thou shalt
keep fast by my young men, until they have end all my harvest.

2:22 and naomi said unto ruth her daughter in law, It is good, my
daughter, that thou go out with hi maidens, that they meet thee not
in ani other field.

2:23 So she kept fast by the maiden of boaz to glean unto the end of
barley harvest and of wheat harvest; and dwelt with her mother in law.

3:1 then naomi her mother in law said unto her, My daughter, shall i
not seek rest for thee, that it may be well with thee?  3:2 and now is
not boaz of our kindred, with whose maiden thou wast?  behold, he
winnoweth barley to night in the threshingfloor.

3:3 wash thyself therefore, and anoint thee, and put thi raiment upon
thee, and get thee down to the floor: but make not thyself known unto
th man, until he shall have done eat and drinking.

3:4 and it shall be, when he lieth down, that thou shalt mark the
plac where he shall lie, and thou shalt go in, and uncov hi feet,
and lay thee down; and he will tell thee what thou shalt do.

3:5 and she said unto her, all that thou sayest unto me I will do.

3:6 and she went down unto the floor, and did accord to all that
her mother in law bade her.

3:7 and when boaz had eaten and drunk, and hi heart wa merry, he
went to lie down at the end of the heap of corn: and she came softly,
and uncov hi feet, and laid her down.

3:8 and it came to pass at midnight, that the man wa afraid, and
turn himself: and, behold, a woman lay at hi feet.

3:9 and he said, who art thou? and she answered, I am ruth thine
handmaid: spread therefor thi skirt over thine handmaid; for thou art
a near kinsman.

3:10 and he said, bless be thou of the lord, my daughter: for thou
hast shew more kind in the latter end than at the beginning,
inasmuch as thou followedst not young men, whether poor or rich.

3:11 and now, my daughter, fear not; I will do to thee all that thou
requirest: for all the citi of my peopl doth know that thou art a
virtu woman.

3:12 and now it is true that I am thi near kinsman: howbeit there is a
kinsman nearer than i.

3:13 tarri thi night, and it shall be in the morning, that if he will
perform unto thee the part of a kinsman, well; let him do the
kinsman' part: but if he will not do the part of a kinsman to thee,
then will I do the part of a kinsman to thee, as the lord liveth: lie
down until the morning.

3:14 and she lay at hi feet until the morning: and she rose up before
on could know another. and he said, let it not be known that a woman
cam into the floor.

3:15 also he said, bring the vail that thou hast upon thee, and hold
it.

and when she held it, he measur six measur of barley, and laid it
on her: and she went into the city.

3:16 and when she came to her mother in law, she said, who art thou,
mi daughter? and she told her all that the man had done to her.

3:17 and she said, these six measur of barley gave he me; for he
said to me, Go not empti unto thi mother in law.

3:18 then said she, sit still, my daughter, until thou know how the
matt will fall: for the man will not be in rest, until he have
finish the thing thi day.

4:1 then went boaz up to the gate, and sat him down there: and,
behold, the kinsman of whom boaz spake came by; unto whom he said, ho,
such a one! turn aside, sit down here. and he turn aside, and sat
down.

4:2 and he took ten men of the elder of the city, and said, sit ye
down here. and they sat down.

4:3 and he said unto the kinsman, naomi, that is come again out of the
countri of moab, selleth a parcel of land, which wa our brother
elimelech's: 4:4 and I thought to advertis thee, saying, buy it
befor the inhabitants, and befor the elder of my people. If thou
wilt redeem it, redeem it: but if thou wilt not redeem it, then tell
me, that I may know: for there is none to redeem it besid thee; and i
am after thee. and he said, I will redeem it.

4:5 then said boaz, what day thou buyest the field of the hand of
naomi, thou must buy it also of ruth the moabitess, the wife of the
dead, to rais up the name of the dead upon hi inheritance.

4:6 and the kinsman said, I cannot redeem it for myself, lest I mar
min own inheritance: redeem thou my right to thyself; for I cannot
redeem it.

4:7 now thi wa the manner in former time in israel concerning
redeem and concern changing, for to confirm all things; a man
pluck off hi shoe, and gave it to hi neighbour: and thi wa a
testimoni in israel.

4:8 therefor the kinsman said unto boaz, buy it for thee. So he drew
off hi shoe.

4:9 and boaz said unto the elders, and unto all the people, Ye are
wit thi day, that I have bought all that wa elimelech's, and
al that wa chilion' and mahlon's, of the hand of naomi.

4:10 moreov ruth the moabitess, the wife of mahlon, have I purchased
to be my wife, to rais up the name of the dead upon hi inheritance,
that the name of the dead be not cut off from among hi brethren, and
from the gate of hi place: ye are wit thi day.

4:11 and all the peopl that were in the gate, and the elders, said,
w are witnesses. the lord make the woman that is come into thine
hous like rachel and like leah, which two did build the hous of
israel: and do thou worthili in ephratah, and be famou in bethlehem:
4:12 and let thi hous be like the hous of pharez, whom tamar bare
unto judah, of the seed which the lord shall give thee of thi young
woman.

4:13 So boaz took ruth, and she wa hi wife: and when he went in unto
her, the lord gave her conception, and she bare a son.

4:14 and the women said unto naomi, bless be the lord, which hath
not left thee thi day without a kinsman, that hi name may be famous
in israel.

4:15 and he shall be unto thee a restor of thi life, and a nourisher
of thine old age: for thi daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is
bett to thee than seven sons, hath born him.

4:16 and naomi took the child, and laid it in her bosom, and became
nurs unto it.

4:17 and the women her neighbour gave it a name, saying, there is a
son born to naomi; and they call hi name obed: he is the father of
jesse, the father of david.

4:18 now these are the gener of pharez: pharez begat hezron,
4:19 and hezron begat ram, and ram begat amminadab, 4:20 and amminadab
begat nahshon, and nahshon begat salmon, 4:21 and salmon begat boaz,
and boaz begat obed, 4:22 and obe begat jesse, and jess begat david.




th first book of samuel

otherwis called:

th first book of the kings


1:1 now there wa a certain man of ramathaimzophim, of mount ephraim,
and hi name wa elkanah, the son of jeroham, the son of elihu, the
son of tohu, the son of zuph, an ephrathite: 1:2 and he had two wives;
th name of the one wa hannah, and the name of the other peninnah:
and peninnah had children, but hannah had no children.

1:3 and thi man went up out of hi citi yearli to worship and to
sacrific unto the lord of host in shiloh. and the two son of eli,
hophni and phinehas, the priest of the lord, were there.

1:4 and when the time wa that elkanah offered, he gave to peninnah
hi wife, and to all her son and her daughters, portions: 1:5 but
unto hannah he gave a worthi portion; for he love hannah: but the
