lord had shut up her womb.

1:6 and her adversari also provok her sore, for to make her fret,
becaus the lord had shut up her womb.

1:7 and as he did so year by year, when she went up to the hous of
th lord, so she provok her; therefor she wept, and did not eat.

1:8 then said elkanah her husband to her, hannah, whi weepest thou?
and whi eatest thou not? and whi is thi heart grieved? am not I better
to thee than ten sons?  1:9 So hannah rose up after they had eaten in
shiloh, and after they had drunk. now eli the priest sat upon a seat
bi a post of the templ of the lord.

1:10 and she wa in bitter of soul, and pray unto the lord, and
wept sore.

1:11 and she vow a vow, and said, O lord of hosts, if thou wilt
inde look on the afflict of thine handmaid, and rememb me, and
not forget thine handmaid, but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man
child, then I will give him unto the lord all the day of hi life,
and there shall no razor come upon hi head.

1:12 and it came to pass, as she continu pray befor the lord,
that eli mark her mouth.

1:13 now hannah, she spake in her heart; onli her lip moved, but her
voic wa not heard: therefor eli thought she had been drunken.

1:14 and eli said unto her, how long wilt thou be drunken? put away
thi wine from thee.

1:15 and hannah answer and said, no, my lord, I am a woman of a
sorrow spirit: I have drunk neither wine nor strong drink, but have
pour out my soul befor the lord.

1:16 count not thine handmaid for a daughter of belial: for out of the
abund of my complaint and grief have I spoken hitherto.

1:17 then eli answer and said, Go in peace: and the god of israel
gr thee thi petit that thou hast ask of him.

1:18 and she said, let thine handmaid find grace in thi sight. So the
woman went her way, and did eat, and her counten wa no more sad.

1:19 and they rose up in the morn early, and worship befor the
lord, and returned, and came to their hous to ramah: and elkanah knew
hannah hi wife; and the lord rememb her.

1:20 wherefor it came to pass, when the time wa come about after
hannah had conceived, that she bare a son, and call hi name samuel,
saying, becaus I have ask him of the lord.

1:21 and the man elkanah, and all hi house, went up to offer unto the
lord the yearli sacrifice, and hi vow.

1:22 but hannah went not up; for she said unto her husband, I will not
go up until the child be weaned, and then I will bring him, that he
may appear befor the lord, and there abid for ever.

1:23 and elkanah her husband said unto her, Do what seemeth thee good;
tarri until thou have wean him; onli the lord establish hi word. so
th woman abode, and gave her son suck until she wean him.

1:24 and when she had wean him, she took him up with her, with three
bullocks, and one ephah of flour, and a bottl of wine, and brought
him unto the hous of the lord in shiloh: and the child wa young.

1:25 and they slew a bullock, and brought the child to eli.

1:26 and she said, Oh my lord, as thi soul liveth, my lord, I am the
woman that stood by thee here, pray unto the lord.

1:27 for thi child I prayed; and the lord hath given me my petition
which I ask of him: 1:28 therefor also I have lent him to the lord;
a long as he liveth he shall be lent to the lord. and he worshipped
th lord there.

2:1 and hannah prayed, and said, My heart rejoiceth in the lord, mine
horn is exalt in the lord: my mouth is enlarg over mine enemies;
becaus I rejoic in thi salvation.

2:2 there is none holi as the lord: for there is none besid thee:
neith is there ani rock like our god.

2:3 talk no more so exceed proudly; let not arrog come out of
your mouth: for the lord is a god of knowledge, and by him action are
weighed.

2:4 the bow of the mighti men are broken, and they that stumbl are
gird with strength.

2:5 they that were full have hire out themselv for bread; and they
that were hungri ceased: so that the barren hath born seven; and she
that hath mani children is wax feeble.

2:6 the lord killeth, and maketh alive: he bringeth down to the grave,
and bringeth up.

2:7 the lord maketh poor, and maketh rich: he bringeth low, and
lifteth up.

2:8 He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth up the beggar
from the dunghill, to set them among princes, and to make them inherit
th throne of glory: for the pillar of the earth are the lord's, and
h hath set the world upon them.

2:9 He will keep the feet of hi saints, and the wick shall be
sil in darkness; for by strength shall no man prevail.

2:10 the adversari of the lord shall be broken to pieces; out of
heaven shall he thunder upon them: the lord shall judg the end of
th earth; and he shall give strength unto hi king, and exalt the
horn of hi anointed.

2:11 and elkanah went to ramah to hi house. and the child did
minist unto the lord befor eli the priest.

2:12 now the son of eli were son of belial; they knew not the lord.

2:13 and the priest' custom with the peopl was, that, when ani man
off sacrifice, the priest' servant came, while the flesh wa in
seething, with a fleshhook of three teeth in hi hand; 2:14 and he
struck it into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; all that the
fleshhook brought up the priest took for himself. So they did in
shiloh unto all the israelit that came thither.

2:15 also befor they burnt the fat, the priest' servant came, and
said to the man that sacrificed, give flesh to roast for the priest;
for he will not have sodden flesh of thee, but raw.

2:16 and if ani man said unto him, let them not fail to burn the fat
presently, and then take as much as thi soul desireth; then he would
answ him, nay; but thou shalt give it me now: and if not, I will
tak it by force.

2:17 wherefor the sin of the young men wa veri great befor the
lord: for men abhor the offer of the lord.

2:18 but samuel minist befor the lord, be a child, gird with
a linen ephod.

2:19 moreov hi mother made him a littl coat, and brought it to him
from year to year, when she came up with her husband to offer the
yearli sacrifice.

2:20 and eli bless elkanah and hi wife, and said, the lord give
the seed of thi woman for the loan which is lent to the lord. and
they went unto their own home.

2:21 and the lord visit hannah, so that she conceived, and bare
thre son and two daughters. and the child samuel grew befor the
lord.

2:22 now eli wa veri old, and heard all that hi son did unto all
israel; and how they lay with the women that assembl at the door of
th tabernacl of the congregation.

2:23 and he said unto them, whi do ye such things? for I hear of your
evil deal by all thi people.

2:24 nay, my sons; for it is no good report that I hear: ye make the
lord' peopl to transgress.

2:25 If one man sin against another, the judg shall judg him: but if
a man sin against the lord, who shall intreat for him? notwithstanding
they hearken not unto the voic of their father, becaus the lord
would slay them.

2:26 and the child samuel grew on, and wa in favour both with the
lord, and also with men.

2:27 and there came a man of god unto eli, and said unto him, thus
saith the lord, did I plainli appear unto the hous of thi father,
when they were in egypt in pharaoh' house?  2:28 and did I choos him
out of all the tribe of israel to be my priest, to offer upon mine
altar, to burn incense, to wear an ephod befor me? and did I give
unto the hous of thi father all the offer made by fire of the
children of israel?  2:29 wherefor kick ye at my sacrific and at
min offering, which I have command in my habitation; and honourest
thi son abov me, to make yourselv fat with the chiefest of all the
off of israel my people?  2:30 wherefor the lord god of israel
saith, I said inde that thi house, and the hous of thi father,
should walk befor me for ever: but now the lord saith, Be it far from
me; for them that honour me I will honour, and they that despis me
shal be lightli esteemed.

2:31 behold, the day come, that I will cut off thine arm, and the arm
of thi father' house, that there shall not be an old man in thine
house.

2:32 and thou shalt see an enemi in my habitation, in all the wealth
which god shall give israel: and there shall not be an old man in
thin hous for ever.

2:33 and the man of thine, whom I shall not cut off from mine altar,
shal be to consum thine eyes, and to griev thine heart: and all the
increas of thine hous shall die in the flower of their age.

2:34 and thi shall be a sign unto thee, that shall come upon thi two
sons, on hophni and phinehas; in one day they shall die both of them.

2:35 and I will rais me up a faith priest, that shall do according
to that which is in mine heart and in my mind: and I will build him a
sur house; and he shall walk befor mine anoint for ever.

2:36 and it shall come to pass, that everi one that is left in thine
hous shall come and crouch to him for a piec of silver and a morsel
of bread, and shall say, put me, I pray thee, into one of the priests'
offices, that I may eat a piec of bread.

3:1 and the child samuel minist unto the lord befor eli. and the
word of the lord wa preciou in those days; there wa no open vision.

3:2 and it came to pass at that time, when eli wa laid down in his
place, and hi eye began to wax dim, that he could not see; 3:3 and
er the lamp of god went out in the templ of the lord, where the ark
of god was, and samuel wa laid down to sleep; 3:4 that the lord
cal samuel: and he answered, here am i.

3:5 and he ran unto eli, and said, here am I; for thou calledst me.
and he said, I call not; lie down again. and he went and lay down.

3:6 and the lord call yet again, samuel. and samuel aros and went
to eli, and said, here am I; for thou didst call me. and he answered,
i call not, my son; lie down again.

3:7 now samuel did not yet know the lord, neither wa the word of the
lord yet reveal unto him.

3:8 and the lord call samuel again the third time. and he aros and
went to eli, and said, here am I; for thou didst call me. and eli
perceiv that the lord had call the child.

3:9 therefor eli said unto samuel, go, lie down: and it shall be, if
h call thee, that thou shalt say, speak, lord; for thi servant
heareth. So samuel went and lay down in hi place.

3:10 and the lord came, and stood, and call as at other times,
samuel, samuel. then samuel answered, speak; for thi servant heareth.

3:11 and the lord said to samuel, behold, I will do a thing in israel,
at which both the ear of everi one that heareth it shall tingle.

3:12 In that day I will perform against eli all thing which I have
spoken concern hi house: when I begin, I will also make an end.

3:13 for I have told him that I will judg hi hous for ever for the
iniqu which he knoweth; becaus hi son made themselv vile, and
h restrain them not.

3:14 and therefor I have sworn unto the hous of eli, that the
iniqu of eli' hous shall not be purg with sacrific nor
off for ever.

3:15 and samuel lay until the morning, and open the door of the
hous of the lord. and samuel fear to shew eli the vision.

3:16 then eli call samuel, and said, samuel, my son. and he
answered, here am i.

3:17 and he said, what is the thing that the lord hath said unto thee?
i pray thee hide it not from me: god do so to thee, and more also, if
thou hide ani thing from me of all the thing that he said unto thee.

3:18 and samuel told him everi whit, and hid noth from him. and he
said, It is the lord: let him do what seemeth him good.

3:19 and samuel grew, and the lord wa with him, and did let none of
hi word fall to the ground.

3:20 and all israel from dan even to beersheba knew that samuel was
establish to be a prophet of the lord.

3:21 and the lord appear again in shiloh: for the lord revealed
himself to samuel in shiloh by the word of the lord.

4:1 and the word of samuel came to all israel. now israel went out
against the philistin to battle, and pitch besid ebenezer: and
th philistin pitch in aphek.

4:2 and the philistin put themselv in array against israel: and
when they join battle, israel wa smitten befor the philistines:
and they slew of the armi in the field about four thousand men.

4:3 and when the peopl were come into the camp, the elder of israel
said, wherefor hath the lord smitten us to day befor the
philistines? let us fetch the ark of the coven of the lord out of
shiloh unto us, that, when it cometh among us, it may save us out of
th hand of our enemies.

4:4 So the peopl sent to shiloh, that they might bring from thence
th ark of the coven of the lord of hosts, which dwelleth between
th cherubims: and the two son of eli, hophni and phinehas, were
ther with the ark of the coven of god.

4:5 and when the ark of the coven of the lord came into the camp,
al israel shout with a great shout, so that the earth rang again.

4:6 and when the philistin heard the nois of the shout, they said,
what meaneth the nois of thi great shout in the camp of the hebrews?
and they understood that the ark of the lord wa come into the camp.

4:7 and the philistin were afraid, for they said, god is come into
th camp. and they said, woe unto us! for there hath not been such a
th heretofore.

4:8 woe unto us! who shall deliv us out of the hand of these mighty
gods? these are the god that smote the egyptian with all the plagues
in the wilderness.

4:9 Be strong and quit yourselv like men, O ye philistines, that ye
b not servant unto the hebrews, as they have been to you: quit
yourselv like men, and fight.

4:10 and the philistin fought, and israel wa smitten, and they fled
everi man into hi tent: and there wa a veri great slaughter; for
ther fell of israel thirti thousand footmen.

4:11 and the ark of god wa taken; and the two son of eli, hophni and
phinehas, were slain.

4:12 and there ran a man of benjamin out of the army, and came to
shiloh the same day with hi cloth rent, and with earth upon his
head.

4:13 and when he came, lo, eli sat upon a seat by the wayside
watching: for hi heart trembl for the ark of god. and when the man
cam into the city, and told it, all the citi cri out.

4:14 and when eli heard the nois of the crying, he said, what meaneth
th nois of thi tumult? and the man came in hastily, and told eli.

4:15 now eli wa nineti and eight year old; and hi eye were dim,
that he could not see.

4:16 and the man said unto eli, I am he that came out of the army, and
i fled to day out of the army. and he said, what is there done, my
son?  4:17 and the messeng answer and said, israel is fled before
th philistines, and there hath been also a great slaughter among the
people, and thi two son also, hophni and phinehas, are dead, and the
ark of god is taken.

4:18 and it came to pass, when he made mention of the ark of god, that
h fell from off the seat backward by the side of the gate, and his
neck brake, and he died: for he wa an old man, and heavy. and he had
judg israel forti years.

4:19 and hi daughter in law, phinehas' wife, wa with child, near to
b delivered: and when she heard the tide that the ark of god was
taken, and that her father in law and her husband were dead, she bowed
herself and travailed; for her pain came upon her.

4:20 and about the time of her death the women that stood by her said
unto her, fear not; for thou hast born a son. but she answer not,
neith did she regard it.

4:21 and she name the child ichabod, saying, the glori is departed
from israel: becaus the ark of god wa taken, and becaus of her
fath in law and her husband.

4:22 and she said, the glori is depart from israel: for the ark of
god is taken.

5:1 and the philistin took the ark of god, and brought it from
ebenez unto ashdod.

5:2 when the philistin took the ark of god, they brought it into the
hous of dagon, and set it by dagon.

5:3 and when they of ashdod aros earli on the morrow, behold, dagon
wa fallen upon hi face to the earth befor the ark of the lord. and
they took dagon, and set him in hi place again.

5:4 and when they aros earli on the morrow morning, behold, dagon was
fallen upon hi face to the ground befor the ark of the lord; and the
head of dagon and both the palm of hi hand were cut off upon the
threshold; onli the stump of dagon wa left to him.

5:5 therefor neither the priest of dagon, nor ani that come into
dagon' house, tread on the threshold of dagon in ashdod unto this
day.

5:6 but the hand of the lord wa heavi upon them of ashdod, and he
destroy them, and smote them with emerods, even ashdod and the
coast thereof.

5:7 and when the men of ashdod saw that it wa so, they said, the ark
of the god of israel shall not abid with us: for hi hand is sore
upon us, and upon dagon our god.

5:8 they sent therefor and gather all the lord of the philistines
unto them, and said, what shall we do with the ark of the god of
israel? and they answered, let the ark of the god of israel be carried
about unto gath. and they carri the ark of the god of israel about
thither.

5:9 and it wa so, that, after they had carri it about, the hand of
th lord wa against the citi with a veri great destruction: and he
smot the men of the city, both small and great, and they had emerods
in their secret parts.

5:10 therefor they sent the ark of god to ekron. and it came to pass,
a the ark of god came to ekron, that the ekronit cri out, saying,
they have brought about the ark of the god of israel to us, to slay us
and our people.

5:11 So they sent and gather togeth all the lord of the
philistines, and said, send away the ark of the god of israel, and let
it go again to hi own place, that it slay us not, and our people: for
ther wa a deadli destruct throughout all the city; the hand of
god wa veri heavi there.

5:12 and the men that die not were smitten with the emerods: and the
cri of the citi went up to heaven.

6:1 and the ark of the lord wa in the countri of the philistines
seven months.

6:2 and the philistin call for the priest and the diviners,
saying, what shall we do to the ark of the lord? tell us wherewith we
shal send it to hi place.

6:3 and they said, If ye send away the ark of the god of israel, send
it not empty; but in ani wise return him a trespass offering: then ye
shal be healed, and it shall be known to you whi hi hand is not
remov from you.

6:4 then said they, what shall be the trespass offer which we shall
return to him? they answered, five golden emerods, and five golden
mice, accord to the number of the lord of the philistines: for one
plagu wa on you all, and on your lords.

6:5 wherefor ye shall make imag of your emerods, and imag of your
mic that mar the land; and ye shall give glori unto the god of
israel: peradventur he will lighten hi hand from off you, and from
off your gods, and from off your land.

6:6 wherefor then do ye harden your hearts, as the egyptian and
pharaoh harden their hearts? when he had wrought wonder among
them, did they not let the peopl go, and they departed?  6:7 now
therefor make a new cart, and take two milch kine, on which there
hath come no yoke, and tie the kine to the cart, and bring their
calv home from them: 6:8 and take the ark of the lord, and lay it
upon the cart; and put the jewel of gold, which ye return him for a
trespass offering, in a coffer by the side thereof; and send it away,
that it may go.

6:9 and see, if it goeth up by the way of hi own coast to
bethshemesh, then he hath done us thi great evil: but if not, then we
shal know that it is not hi hand that smote us: it wa a chanc that
happen to us.

6:10 and the men did so; and took two milch kine, and tie them to the
cart, and shut up their calv at home: 6:11 and they laid the ark of
th lord upon the cart, and the coffer with the mice of gold and the
imag of their emerods.

6:12 and the kine took the straight way to the way of bethshemesh, and
went along the highway, low as they went, and turn not asid to
th right hand or to the left; and the lord of the philistin went
aft them unto the border of bethshemesh.

6:13 and they of bethshemesh were reap their wheat harvest in the
valley: and they lift up their eyes, and saw the ark, and rejoiced
to see it.

6:14 and the cart came into the field of joshua, a bethshemite, and
stood there, where there wa a great stone: and they clave the wood of
th cart, and offer the kine a burnt offer unto the lord.

6:15 and the levit took down the ark of the lord, and the coffer
that wa with it, wherein the jewel of gold were, and put them on the
great stone: and the men of bethshemesh offer burnt offer and
sacrif sacrific the same day unto the lord.

6:16 and when the five lord of the philistin had seen it, they
return to ekron the same day.

6:17 and these are the golden emerod which the philistin returned
for a trespass offer unto the lord; for ashdod one, for gaza one,
for askelon one, for gath one, for ekron one; 6:18 and the golden
mice, accord to the number of all the citi of the philistines
belong to the five lords, both of fenc cities, and of country
villages, even unto the great stone of abel, whereon they set down the
ark of the lord: which stone remaineth unto thi day in the field of
joshua, the bethshemite.

6:19 and he smote the men of bethshemesh, becaus they had look into
th ark of the lord, even he smote of the peopl fifti thousand and
threescor and ten men: and the peopl lamented, becaus the lord had
smitten mani of the peopl with a great slaughter.

6:20 and the men of bethshemesh said, who is abl to stand befor this
holi lord god? and to whom shall he go up from us?  6:21 and they sent
messeng to the inhabit of kirjathjearim, saying, the
philistin have brought again the ark of the lord; come ye down, and
fetch it up to you.

7:1 and the men of kirjathjearim came, and fetch up the ark of the
lord, and brought it into the hous of abinadab in the hill, and
sanctifi eleazar hi son to keep the ark of the lord.

7:2 and it came to pass, while the ark abod in kirjathjearim, that
th time wa long; for it wa twenti years: and all the hous of
israel lament after the lord.

7:3 and samuel spake unto all the hous of israel, saying, If ye do
return unto the lord with all your hearts, then put away the strange
god and ashtaroth from among you, and prepar your heart unto the
lord, and serv him only: and he will deliv you out of the hand of
th philistines.

7:4 then the children of israel did put away baalim and ashtaroth, and
serv the lord only.

7:5 and samuel said, gather all israel to mizpeh, and I will pray for
you unto the lord.

7:6 and they gather togeth to mizpeh, and drew water, and poured
it out befor the lord, and fast on that day, and said there, we
hav sin against the lord. and samuel judg the children of israel
in mizpeh.

7:7 and when the philistin heard that the children of israel were
gath togeth to mizpeh, the lord of the philistin went up
against israel. and when the children of israel heard it, they were
afraid of the philistines.

7:8 and the children of israel said to samuel, ceas not to cri unto
th lord our god for us, that he will save us out of the hand of the
philistines.

7:9 and samuel took a suck lamb, and offer it for a burnt
off wholli unto the lord: and samuel cri unto the lord for
israel; and the lord heard him.

7:10 and as samuel wa offer up the burnt offering, the philistines
drew near to battl against israel: but the lord thunder with a
great thunder on that day upon the philistines, and discomfit them;
and they were smitten befor israel.

7:11 and the men of israel went out of mizpeh, and pursu the
philistines, and smote them, until they came under bethcar.

7:12 then samuel took a stone, and set it between mizpeh and shen, and
cal the name of it ebenezer, saying, hitherto hath the lord helped
us.

7:13 So the philistin were subdued, and they came no more into the
coast of israel: and the hand of the lord wa against the philistines
al the day of samuel.

7:14 and the citi which the philistin had taken from israel were
restor to israel, from ekron even unto gath; and the coast thereof
did israel deliv out of the hand of the philistines. and there was
peac between israel and the amorites.

7:15 and samuel judg israel all the day of hi life.

7:16 and he went from year to year in circuit to bethel, and gilgal,
and mizpeh, and judg israel in all those places.

7:17 and hi return wa to ramah; for there wa hi house; and there
h judg israel; and there he built an altar unto the lord.

8:1 and it came to pass, when samuel wa old, that he made hi sons
judg over israel.

8:2 now the name of hi firstborn wa joel; and the name of his
second, abiah: they were judg in beersheba.

8:3 and hi son walk not in hi ways, but turn asid after lucre,
and took bribes, and pervert judgment.

8:4 then all the elder of israel gather themselv together, and
cam to samuel unto ramah, 8:5 and said unto him, behold, thou art
old, and thi son walk not in thi ways: now make us a king to judg us
lik all the nations.

8:6 but the thing displeas samuel, when they said, give us a king to
judg us. and samuel pray unto the lord.

8:7 and the lord said unto samuel, hearken unto the voic of the
peopl in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected
thee, but they have reject me, that I should not reign over them.

8:8 accord to all the work which they have done sinc the day that
i brought them up out of egypt even unto thi day, wherewith they have
forsaken me, and serv other gods, so do they also unto thee.

8:9 now therefor hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest
solemnli unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall
reign over them.

8:10 and samuel told all the word of the lord unto the peopl that
ask of him a king.

8:11 and he said, thi will be the manner of the king that shall reign
ov you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for
hi chariots, and to be hi horsemen; and some shall run befor his
chariots.

8:12 and he will appoint him captain over thousands, and captains
ov fifties; and will set them to ear hi ground, and to reap his
harvest, and to make hi instrument of war, and instrument of his
chariots.

8:13 and he will take your daughter to be confectionaries, and to be
cooks, and to be bakers.

8:14 and he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your
oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to hi servants.

8:15 and he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards,
and give to hi officers, and to hi servants.

8:16 and he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and
your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to hi work.

8:17 He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his
servants.

8:18 and ye shall cri out in that day becaus of your king which ye
shal have chosen you; and the lord will not hear you in that day.

8:19 nevertheless the peopl refus to obey the voic of samuel; and
they said, nay; but we will have a king over us; 8:20 that we also may
b like all the nations; and that our king may judg us, and go out
befor us, and fight our battles.

8:21 and samuel heard all the word of the people, and he rehearsed
them in the ear of the lord.

8:22 and the lord said to samuel, hearken unto their voice, and make
them a king. and samuel said unto the men of israel, Go ye everi man
unto hi city.

9:1 now there wa a man of benjamin, whose name wa kish, the son of
abiel, the son of zeror, the son of bechorath, the son of aphiah, a
benjamite, a mighti man of power.

9:2 and he had a son, whose name wa saul, a choic young man, and a
goodly: and there wa not among the children of israel a goodlier
person than he: from hi shoulder and upward he wa higher than any
of the people.

9:3 and the ass of kish saul' father were lost. and kish said to
saul hi son, take now one of the servant with thee, and arise, go
seek the asses.

9:4 and he pass through mount ephraim, and pass through the land
of shalisha, but they found them not: then they pass through the
land of shalim, and there they were not: and he pass through the
land of the benjamites, but they found them not.

9:5 and when they were come to the land of zuph, saul said to his
serv that wa with him, come, and let us return; lest my father
leav care for the asses, and take thought for us.

9:6 and he said unto him, behold now, there is in thi citi a man of
god, and he is an honour man; all that he saith cometh sure to
pass: now let us go thither; peradventur he can shew us our way that
w should go.

9:7 then said saul to hi servant, but, behold, if we go, what shall
w bring the man? for the bread is spent in our vessels, and there is
not a present to bring to the man of god: what have we?  9:8 and the
serv answer saul again, and said, behold, I have here at hand the
fourth part of a shekel of silver: that will I give to the man of god,
to tell us our way.

9:9 (beforetim in israel, when a man went to enquir of god, thu he
spake, come, and let us go to the seer: for he that is now call a
prophet wa beforetim call a seer.)  9:10 then said saul to his
servant, well said; come, let us go. So they went unto the citi where
th man of god was.

9:11 and as they went up the hill to the city, they found young
maiden go out to draw water, and said unto them, Is the seer here?
9:12 and they answer them, and said, He is; behold, he is before
you: make hast now, for he came to day to the city; for there is a
sacrific of the peopl to day in the high place: 9:13 As soon as ye
b come into the city, ye shall straightway find him, befor he go up
to the high place to eat: for the peopl will not eat until he come,
becaus he doth bless the sacrifice; and afterward they eat that be
bidden. now therefor get you up; for about thi time ye shall find
him.

9:14 and they went up into the city: and when they were come into the
city, behold, samuel came out against them, for to go up to the high
place.

9:15 now the lord had told samuel in hi ear a day befor saul came,
saying, 9:16 To morrow about thi time I will send thee a man out of
th land of benjamin, and thou shalt anoint him to be captain over my
peopl israel, that he may save my peopl out of the hand of the
philistines: for I have look upon my people, becaus their cri is
com unto me.

9:17 and when samuel saw saul, the lord said unto him, behold the man
whom I spake to thee of! thi same shall reign over my people.

9:18 then saul drew near to samuel in the gate, and said, tell me, i
pray thee, where the seer' hous is.

9:19 and samuel answer saul, and said, I am the seer: go up before
m unto the high place; for ye shall eat with me to day, and to morrow
i will let thee go, and will tell thee all that is in thine heart.

9:20 and as for thine ass that were lost three day ago, set not thy
mind on them; for they are found. and on whom is all the desir of
israel? Is it not on thee, and on all thi father' house?  9:21 and
saul answer and said, Am not I a benjamite, of the smallest of the
trib of israel? and my famili the least of all the famili of the
trib of benjamin? wherefor then speakest thou so to me?  9:22 and
samuel took saul and hi servant, and brought them into the parlour,
and made them sit in the chiefest place among them that were bidden,
which were about thirti persons.

9:23 and samuel said unto the cook, bring the portion which I gave
thee, of which I said unto thee, set it by thee.

9:24 and the cook took up the shoulder, and that which wa upon it,
and set it befor saul. and samuel said, behold that which is left!
set it befor thee, and eat: for unto thi time hath it been kept for
the sinc I said, I have invit the people. So saul did eat with
samuel that day.

9:25 and when they were come down from the high place into the city,
samuel commun with saul upon the top of the house.

9:26 and they aros early: and it came to pass about the spring of the
day, that samuel call saul to the top of the house, saying, up, that
i may send thee away. and saul arose, and they went out both of them,
h and samuel, abroad.

9:27 and as they were go down to the end of the city, samuel said
to saul, bid the servant pass on befor us, (and he pass on), but
stand thou still a while, that I may shew thee the word of god.

10:1 then samuel took a vial of oil, and pour it upon hi head, and
kiss him, and said, Is it not becaus the lord hath anoint thee to
b captain over hi inheritance?  10:2 when thou art depart from me
to day, then thou shalt find two men by rachel' sepulchr in the
bord of benjamin at zelzah; and they will say unto thee, the asses
which thou wentest to seek are found: and, lo, thi father hath left
th care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, what shall I do
for my son?  10:3 then shalt thou go on forward from thence, and thou
shalt come to the plain of tabor, and there shall meet thee three men
go up to god to bethel, one carri three kids, and another
carri three loav of bread, and anoth carri a bottl of wine:
10:4 and they will salut thee, and give thee two loav of bread;
which thou shalt receiv of their hands.

10:5 after that thou shalt come to the hill of god, where is the
garrison of the philistines: and it shall come to pass, when thou art
com thither to the city, that thou shalt meet a compani of prophets
com down from the high place with a psaltery, and a tabret, and a
pipe, and a harp, befor them; and they shall prophesy: 10:6 and the
spirit of the lord will come upon thee, and thou shalt prophesi with
them, and shalt be turn into anoth man.

10:7 and let it be, when these sign are come unto thee, that thou do
a occas serv thee; for god is with thee.

10:8 and thou shalt go down befor me to gilgal; and, behold, I will
com down unto thee, to offer burnt offerings, and to sacrifice
sacrific of peac offerings: seven day shalt thou tarry, till i
com to thee, and shew thee what thou shalt do.

10:9 and it wa so, that when he had turn hi back to go from
samuel, god gave him anoth heart: and all those sign came to pass
that day.

10:10 and when they came thither to the hill, behold, a compani of
prophet met him; and the spirit of god came upon him, and he
prophesi among them.

10:11 and it came to pass, when all that knew him beforetim saw that,
behold, he prophesi among the prophets, then the peopl said one to
another, what is thi that is come unto the son of kish? Is saul also
among the prophets?  10:12 and one of the same place answer and
said, but who is their father? therefor it becam a proverb, Is saul
also among the prophets?  10:13 and when he had made an end of
prophesying, he came to the high place.

10:14 and saul' uncl said unto him and to hi servant, whither went
ye?  and he said, To seek the asses: and when we saw that they were no
where, we came to samuel.

10:15 and saul' uncl said, tell me, I pray thee, what samuel said
unto you.

10:16 and saul said unto hi uncle, He told us plainli that the asses
wer found. but of the matter of the kingdom, whereof samuel spake, he
told him not.

10:17 and samuel call the peopl togeth unto the lord to mizpeh;
10:18 and said unto the children of israel, thu saith the lord god of
israel, I brought up israel out of egypt, and deliv you out of the
hand of the egyptians, and out of the hand of all kingdoms, and of
them that oppress you: 10:19 and ye have thi day reject your god,
who himself save you out of all your advers and your
tribulations; and ye have said unto him, nay, but set a king over us.
now therefor present yourselv befor the lord by your tribes, and
bi your thousands.

10:20 and when samuel had caus all the tribe of israel to come
near, the tribe of benjamin wa taken.

10:21 when he had caus the tribe of benjamin to come near by their
families, the famili of matri wa taken, and saul the son of kish was
taken: and when they sought him, he could not be found.

10:22 therefor they enquir of the lord further, if the man should
yet come thither. and the lord answered, behold he hath hid himself
among the stuff.

10:23 and they ran and fetch him thence: and when he stood among the
people, he wa higher than ani of the peopl from hi shoulder and
upward.

10:24 and samuel said to all the people, see ye him whom the lord hath
chosen, that there is none like him among all the people? and all the
peopl shouted, and said, god save the king.

10:25 then samuel told the peopl the manner of the kingdom, and wrote
it in a book, and laid it up befor the lord. and samuel sent all the
peopl away, everi man to hi house.

10:26 and saul also went home to gibeah; and there went with him a
band of men, whose heart god had touched.

10:27 but the children of belial said, how shall thi man save us? and
they despis him, and brought no presents. but he held hi peace.

11:1 then nahash the ammonit came up, and encamp against
jabeshgilead: and all the men of jabesh said unto nahash, make a
coven with us, and we will serv thee.

11:2 and nahash the ammonit answer them, On thi condit will i
mak a coven with you, that I may thrust out all your right eyes,
and lay it for a reproach upon all israel.

11:3 and the elder of jabesh said unto him, give us seven days'
respite, that we may send messeng unto all the coast of israel:
and then, if there be no man to save us, we will come out to thee.

11:4 then came the messeng to gibeah of saul, and told the tidings
in the ear of the people: and all the peopl lift up their voices,
and wept.

11:5 and, behold, saul came after the herd out of the field; and saul
said, what aileth the peopl that they weep? and they told him the
tid of the men of jabesh.

11:6 and the spirit of god came upon saul when he heard those tidings,
and hi anger wa kindl greatly.

11:7 and he took a yoke of oxen, and hew them in pieces, and sent
them throughout all the coast of israel by the hand of messengers,
saying, whosoev cometh not forth after saul and after samuel, so
shal it be done unto hi oxen. and the fear of the lord fell on the
people, and they came out with one consent.

11:8 and when he number them in bezek, the children of israel were
thre hundr thousand, and the men of judah thirti thousand.

11:9 and they said unto the messeng that came, thu shall ye say
unto the men of jabeshgilead, To morrow, by that time the sun be hot,
y shall have help. and the messeng came and shew it to the men
of jabesh; and they were glad.

11:10 therefor the men of jabesh said, To morrow we will come out
unto you, and ye shall do with us all that seemeth good unto you.

11:11 and it wa so on the morrow, that saul put the peopl in three
companies; and they came into the midst of the host in the morning
watch, and slew the ammonit until the heat of the day: and it came
to pass, that they which remain were scattered, so that two of them
wer not left together.

11:12 and the peopl said unto samuel, who is he that said, shall saul
reign over us? bring the men, that we may put them to death.

11:13 and saul said, there shall not a man be put to death thi day:
for to day the lord hath wrought salvat in israel.

11:14 then said samuel to the people, come, and let us go to gilgal,
and renew the kingdom there.

11:15 and all the peopl went to gilgal; and there they made saul king
befor the lord in gilgal; and there they sacrif sacrific of
peac offer befor the lord; and there saul and all the men of
israel rejoic greatly.

12:1 and samuel said unto all israel, behold, I have hearken unto
your voic in all that ye said unto me, and have made a king over you.

12:2 and now, behold, the king walketh befor you: and I am old and
grayheaded; and, behold, my son are with you: and I have walked
befor you from my childhood unto thi day.

12:3 behold, here I am: wit against me befor the lord, and before
hi anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or
whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have i
receiv ani bribe to blind mine eye therewith? and I will restor it
you.

12:4 and they said, thou hast not defraud us, nor oppress us,
neith hast thou taken ought of ani man' hand.

12:5 and he said unto them, the lord is wit against you, and his
anoint is wit thi day, that ye have not found ought in my hand.
and they answered, He is witness.

12:6 and samuel said unto the people, It is the lord that advanced
mos and aaron, and that brought your father up out of the land of
egypt.

12:7 now therefor stand still, that I may reason with you befor the
lord of all the righteou act of the lord, which he did to you and to
your fathers.

12:8 when jacob wa come into egypt, and your father cri unto the
lord, then the lord sent mose and aaron, which brought forth your
fath out of egypt, and made them dwell in thi place.

12:9 and when they forgat the lord their god, he sold them into the
hand of sisera, captain of the host of hazor, and into the hand of the
philistines, and into the hand of the king of moab, and they fought
against them.

12:10 and they cri unto the lord, and said, We have sinned, because
w have forsaken the lord, and have serv baalim and ashtaroth: but
now deliv us out of the hand of our enemies, and we will serv thee.

12:11 and the lord sent jerubbaal, and bedan, and jephthah, and
samuel, and deliv you out of the hand of your enemi on every
side, and ye dwell safe.

12:12 and when ye saw that nahash the king of the children of ammon
cam against you, ye said unto me, nay; but a king shall reign over
us: when the lord your god wa your king.

12:13 now therefor behold the king whom ye have chosen, and whom ye
hav desired! and, behold, the lord hath set a king over you.

12:14 If ye will fear the lord, and serv him, and obey hi voice, and
not rebel against the command of the lord, then shall both ye and
also the king that reigneth over you continu follow the lord your
god: 12:15 but if ye will not obey the voic of the lord, but rebel
against the command of the lord, then shall the hand of the lord
b against you, as it wa against your fathers.

12:16 now therefor stand and see thi great thing, which the lord
wil do befor your eyes.

12:17 Is it not wheat harvest to day? I will call unto the lord, and
h shall send thunder and rain; that ye may perceiv and see that your
wicked is great, which ye have done in the sight of the lord, in
ask you a king.

12:18 So samuel call unto the lord; and the lord sent thunder and
rain that day: and all the peopl greatli fear the lord and samuel.

12:19 and all the peopl said unto samuel, pray for thi servant unto
th lord thi god, that we die not: for we have ad unto all our sins
thi evil, to ask us a king.

12:20 and samuel said unto the people, fear not: ye have done all this
wickedness: yet turn not asid from follow the lord, but serv the
lord with all your heart; 12:21 and turn ye not aside: for then should
y go after vain things, which cannot profit nor deliver; for they are
vain.

12:22 for the lord will not forsak hi peopl for hi great name's
sake: becaus it hath pleas the lord to make you hi people.

12:23 moreov as for me, god forbid that I should sin against the
lord in ceas to pray for you: but I will teach you the good and the
right way: 12:24 onli fear the lord, and serv him in truth with all
your heart: for consid how great thing he hath done for you.

12:25 but if ye shall still do wickedly, ye shall be consumed, both ye
and your king.

13:1 saul reign one year; and when he had reign two year over
israel, 13:2 saul chose him three thousand men of israel; whereof two
thousand were with saul in michmash and in mount bethel, and a
thousand were with jonathan in gibeah of benjamin: and the rest of the
peopl he sent everi man to hi tent.

13:3 and jonathan smote the garrison of the philistin that wa in
geba, and the philistin heard of it. and saul blew the trumpet
throughout all the land, saying, let the hebrew hear.

13:4 and all israel heard say that saul had smitten a garrison of the
philistines, and that israel also wa had in abomin with the
philistines. and the peopl were call togeth after saul to gilgal.

13:5 and the philistin gather themselv togeth to fight with
israel, thirti thousand chariots, and six thousand horsemen, and
peopl as the sand which is on the sea shore in multitude: and they
cam up, and pitch in michmash, eastward from bethaven.

13:6 when the men of israel saw that they were in a strait, (for the
peopl were distressed,) then the peopl did hide themselv in caves,
and in thickets, and in rocks, and in high places, and in pits.

13:7 and some of the hebrew went over jordan to the land of gad and
gilead. As for saul, he wa yet in gilgal, and all the peopl followed
him trembling.

13:8 and he tarri seven days, accord to the set time that samuel
had appointed: but samuel came not to gilgal; and the peopl were
scatt from him.

13:9 and saul said, bring hither a burnt offer to me, and peace
offerings. and he offer the burnt offering.

13:10 and it came to pass, that as soon as he had made an end of
off the burnt offering, behold, samuel came; and saul went out to
meet him, that he might salut him.

13:11 and samuel said, what hast thou done? and saul said, becaus i
saw that the peopl were scatter from me, and that thou camest not
within the day appointed, and that the philistin gathered
themselv togeth at michmash; 13:12 therefor said I, the
philistin will come down now upon me to gilgal, and I have not made
suppl unto the lord: I forc myself therefore, and offer a
burnt offering.

13:13 and samuel said to saul, thou hast done foolishly: thou hast not
kept the command of the lord thi god, which he command thee: for
now would the lord have establish thi kingdom upon israel for ever.

13:14 but now thi kingdom shall not continue: the lord hath sought him
a man after hi own heart, and the lord hath command him to be
captain over hi people, becaus thou hast not kept that which the
lord command thee.

13:15 and samuel arose, and gat him up from gilgal unto gibeah of
benjamin. and saul number the peopl that were present with him,
about six hundr men.

13:16 and saul, and jonathan hi son, and the peopl that were present
with them, abod in gibeah of benjamin: but the philistin encamped
in michmash.

13:17 and the spoiler came out of the camp of the philistin in
thre companies: one compani turn unto the way that leadeth to
ophrah, unto the land of shual: 13:18 and anoth compani turn the
way to bethhoron: and anoth compani turn to the way of the border
that looketh to the valley of zeboim toward the wilderness.

13:19 now there wa no smith found throughout all the land of israel:
for the philistin said, lest the hebrew make them sword or spears:
13:20 but all the israelit went down to the philistines, to sharpen
everi man hi share, and hi coulter, and hi axe, and hi mattock.

13:21 yet they had a file for the mattocks, and for the coulters, and
for the forks, and for the axes, and to sharpen the goads.

13:22 So it came to pass in the day of battle, that there wa neither
sword nor spear found in the hand of ani of the peopl that were with
saul and jonathan: but with saul and with jonathan hi son wa there
found.

13:23 and the garrison of the philistin went out to the passag of
michmash.

14:1 now it came to pass upon a day, that jonathan the son of saul
said unto the young man that bare hi armour, come, and let us go over
to the philistines' garrison, that is on the other side. but he told
not hi father.

14:2 and saul tarri in the uttermost part of gibeah under a
pomegran tree which is in migron: and the peopl that were with him
wer about six hundr men; 14:3 and ahiah, the son of ahitub,
ichabod' brother, the son of phinehas, the son of eli, the lord's
priest in shiloh, wear an ephod. and the peopl knew not that
jonathan wa gone.

14:4 and between the passages, by which jonathan sought to go over
unto the philistines' garrison, there wa a sharp rock on the one
side, and a sharp rock on the other side: and the name of the one was
bozez, and the name of the other seneh.

14:5 the forefront of the one wa situat northward over against
michmash, and the other southward over against gibeah.

14:6 and jonathan said to the young man that bare hi armour, come,
and let us go over unto the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be
that the lord will work for us: for there is no restraint to the lord
to save by mani or by few.

14:7 and hi armourbear said unto him, Do all that is in thine
heart: turn thee; behold, I am with thee accord to thi heart.

14:8 then said jonathan, behold, we will pass over unto these men, and
w will discov ourselv unto them.

14:9 If they say thu unto us, tarri until we come to you; then we
wil stand still in our place, and will not go up unto them.

14:10 but if they say thus, come up unto us; then we will go up: for
th lord hath deliv them into our hand: and thi shall be a sign
unto us.

14:11 and both of them discov themselv unto the garrison of the
philistines: and the philistin said, behold, the hebrew come forth
out of the hole where they had hid themselves.

14:12 and the men of the garrison answer jonathan and his
armourbearer, and said, come up to us, and we will shew you a thing.
and jonathan said unto hi armourbearer, come up after me: for the
lord hath deliv them into the hand of israel.

14:13 and jonathan climb up upon hi hand and upon hi feet, and
hi armourbear after him: and they fell befor jonathan; and his
armourbear slew after him.

14:14 and that first slaughter, which jonathan and hi armourbearer
made, wa about twenti men, within as it were an half acr of land,
which a yoke of oxen might plow.

14:15 and there wa trembl in the host, in the field, and among all
th people: the garrison, and the spoilers, they also trembled, and
th earth quaked: so it wa a veri great trembling.

14:16 and the watchmen of saul in gibeah of benjamin looked; and,
behold, the multitud melt away, and they went on beat down one
another.

14:17 then said saul unto the peopl that were with him, number now,
and see who is gone from us. and when they had numbered, behold,
jonathan and hi armourbear were not there.

14:18 and saul said unto ahiah, bring hither the ark of god. for the
ark of god wa at that time with the children of israel.

14:19 and it came to pass, while saul talk unto the priest, that the
nois that wa in the host of the philistin went on and increased:
and saul said unto the priest, withdraw thine hand.

14:20 and saul and all the peopl that were with him assembled
themselves, and they came to the battle: and, behold, everi man's
sword wa against hi fellow, and there wa a veri great discomfiture.

14:21 moreov the hebrew that were with the philistin befor that
time, which went up with them into the camp from the countri round
about, even they also turn to be with the israelit that were with
saul and jonathan.

14:22 likewis all the men of israel which had hid themselv in mount
ephraim, when they heard that the philistin fled, even they also
follow hard after them in the battle.

14:23 So the lord save israel that day: and the battl pass over
unto bethaven.

14:24 and the men of israel were distress that day: for saul had
adjur the people, saying, curs be the man that eateth ani food
until evening, that I may be aveng on mine enemies. So none of the
peopl tast ani food.

14:25 and all they of the land came to a wood; and there wa honey
upon the ground.

14:26 and when the peopl were come into the wood, behold, the honey
dropped; but no man put hi hand to hi mouth: for the peopl feared
th oath.

14:27 but jonathan heard not when hi father charg the peopl with
th oath: wherefor he put forth the end of the rod that wa in his
hand, and dip it in an honeycomb, and put hi hand to hi mouth;
and hi eye were enlightened.

14:28 then answer one of the people, and said, thi father straitly
charg the peopl with an oath, saying, curs be the man that eateth
ani food thi day. and the peopl were faint.

14:29 then said jonathan, My father hath troubl the land: see, i
pray you, how mine eye have been enlightened, becaus I tast a
littl of thi honey.

14:30 how much more, if hapli the peopl had eaten freeli to day of
th spoil of their enemi which they found? for had there not been
now a much greater slaughter among the philistines?  14:31 and they
smot the philistin that day from michmash to aijalon: and the
peopl were veri faint.

14:32 and the peopl flew upon the spoil, and took sheep, and oxen,
and calves, and slew them on the ground: and the peopl did eat them
with the blood.

14:33 then they told saul, saying, behold, the peopl sin against the
lord, in that they eat with the blood. and he said, Ye have
transgressed: roll a great stone unto me thi day.

14:34 and saul said, dispers yourselv among the people, and say
unto them, bring me hither everi man hi ox, and everi man hi sheep,
and slay them here, and eat; and sin not against the lord in eating
with the blood.

and all the peopl brought everi man hi ox with him that night, and
slew them there.

14:35 and saul built an altar unto the lord: the same wa the first
altar that he built unto the lord.

14:36 and saul said, let us go down after the philistin by night,
and spoil them until the morn light, and let us not leav a man of
them. and they said, Do whatsoev seemeth good unto thee. then said
th priest, let us draw near hither unto god.

14:37 and saul ask counsel of god, shall I go down after the
philistines? wilt thou deliv them into the hand of israel? but he
answ him not that day.

14:38 and saul said, draw ye near hither, all the chief of the people:
and know and see wherein thi sin hath been thi day.

14:39 for, as the lord liveth, which saveth israel, though it be in
jonathan my son, he shall sure die. but there wa not a man among
al the peopl that answer him.

14:40 then said he unto all israel, Be ye on one side, and I and
jonathan my son will be on the other side. and the peopl said unto
saul, Do what seemeth good unto thee.

14:41 therefor saul said unto the lord god of israel, give a perfect
lot.

and saul and jonathan were taken: but the peopl escaped.

14:42 and saul said, cast lot between me and jonathan my son. and
jonathan wa taken.

14:43 then saul said to jonathan, tell me what thou hast done. and
jonathan told him, and said, I did but tast a littl honey with the
end of the rod that wa in mine hand, and, lo, I must die.

14:44 and saul answered, god do so and more also: for thou shalt
sur die, jonathan.

14:45 and the peopl said unto saul, shall jonathan die, who hath
wrought thi great salvat in israel? god forbid: as the lord
liveth, there shall not one hair of hi head fall to the ground; for
h hath wrought with god thi day. So the peopl rescu jonathan,
that he die not.

14:46 then saul went up from follow the philistines: and the
philistin went to their own place.

14:47 So saul took the kingdom over israel, and fought against all his
enemi on everi side, against moab, and against the children of
ammon, and against edom, and against the king of zobah, and against
th philistines: and whithersoev he turn himself, he vex them.

14:48 and he gather an host, and smote the amalekites, and delivered
israel out of the hand of them that spoil them.

14:49 now the son of saul were jonathan, and ishui, and melchishua:
and the name of hi two daughter were these; the name of the
firstborn merab, and the name of the younger michal: 14:50 and the
nam of saul' wife wa ahinoam, the daughter of ahimaaz: and the name
of the captain of hi host wa abner, the son of ner, saul' uncle.

14:51 and kish wa the father of saul; and ner the father of abner was
th son of abiel.

14:52 and there wa sore war against the philistin all the day of
saul: and when saul saw ani strong man, or ani valiant man, he took
him unto him.

15:1 samuel also said unto saul, the lord sent me to anoint thee to be
k over hi people, over israel: now therefor hearken thou unto the
voic of the word of the lord.

15:2 thu saith the lord of hosts, I rememb that which amalek did to
israel, how he laid wait for him in the way, when he came up from
egypt.

15:3 now go and smite amalek, and utterli destroy all that they have,
and spare them not; but slay both man and woman, infant and suckling,
ox and sheep, camel and ass.

15:4 and saul gather the peopl together, and number them in
telaim, two hundr thousand footmen, and ten thousand men of judah.

15:5 and saul came to a citi of amalek, and laid wait in the valley.

15:6 and saul said unto the kenites, go, depart, get you down from
among the amalekites, lest I destroy you with them: for ye shewed
kind to all the children of israel, when they came up out of
egypt. So the kenit depart from among the amalekites.

15:7 and saul smote the amalekit from havilah until thou comest to
shur, that is over against egypt.

15:8 and he took agag the king of the amalekit alive, and utterly
destroy all the peopl with the edg of the sword.

15:9 but saul and the peopl spare agag, and the best of the sheep,
and of the oxen, and of the fatlings, and the lambs, and all that was
good, and would not utterli destroy them: but everi thing that was
vil and refuse, that they destroy utterly.

15:10 then came the word of the lord unto samuel, saying, 15:11 it
repenteth me that I have set up saul to be king: for he is turn back
from follow me, and hath not perform my commandments. and it
griev samuel; and he cri unto the lord all night.

15:12 and when samuel rose earli to meet saul in the morning, it was
told samuel, saying, saul came to carmel, and, behold, he set him up a
place, and is gone about, and pass on, and gone down to gilgal.

15:13 and samuel came to saul: and saul said unto him, bless be thou
of the lord: I have perform the command of the lord.

15:14 and samuel said, what meaneth then thi bleat of the sheep in
min ears, and the low of the oxen which I hear?  15:15 and saul
said, they have brought them from the amalekites: for the people
spar the best of the sheep and of the oxen, to sacrific unto the
lord thi god; and the rest we have utterli destroyed.

15:16 then samuel said unto saul, stay, and I will tell thee what the
lord hath said to me thi night. and he said unto him, say on.

15:17 and samuel said, when thou wast littl in thine own sight, wast
thou not made the head of the tribe of israel, and the lord anointed
the king over israel?  15:18 and the lord sent thee on a journey, and
said, Go and utterli destroy the sinner the amalekites, and fight
against them until they be consumed.

15:19 wherefor then didst thou not obey the voic of the lord, but
didst fli upon the spoil, and didst evil in the sight of the lord?
15:20 and saul said unto samuel, yea, I have obey the voic of the
lord, and have gone the way which the lord sent me, and have brought
agag the king of amalek, and have utterli destroy the amalekites.

15:21 but the peopl took of the spoil, sheep and oxen, the chief of
th thing which should have been utterli destroyed, to sacrific unto
th lord thi god in gilgal.

15:22 and samuel said, hath the lord as great delight in burnt
off and sacrifices, as in obey the voic of the lord? behold,
to obey is better than sacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of rams.

15:23 for rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, and stubborn is
a iniqu and idolatry. becaus thou hast reject the word of the
lord, he hath also reject thee from be king.

15:24 and saul said unto samuel, I have sinned: for I have
transgress the command of the lord, and thi words: becaus i
fear the people, and obey their voice.

15:25 now therefore, I pray thee, pardon my sin, and turn again with
me, that I may worship the lord.

15:26 and samuel said unto saul, I will not return with thee: for thou
hast reject the word of the lord, and the lord hath reject thee
from be king over israel.

15:27 and as samuel turn about to go away, he laid hold upon the
skirt of hi mantle, and it rent.

15:28 and samuel said unto him, the lord hath rent the kingdom of
israel from thee thi day, and hath given it to a neighbour of thine,
that is better than thou.

15:29 and also the strength of israel will not lie nor repent: for he
i not a man, that he should repent.

15:30 then he said, I have sinned: yet honour me now, I pray thee,
befor the elder of my people, and befor israel, and turn again with
me, that I may worship the lord thi god.

15:31 So samuel turn again after saul; and saul worship the lord.

15:32 then said samuel, bring ye hither to me agag the king of the
amalekites. and agag came unto him delicately. and agag said, surely
th bitter of death is past.

15:33 and samuel said, As the sword hath made women childless, so
shal thi mother be childless among women. and samuel hew agag in
piec befor the lord in gilgal.

15:34 then samuel went to ramah; and saul went up to hi hous to
gibeah of saul.

15:35 and samuel came no more to see saul until the day of hi death:
nevertheless samuel mourn for saul: and the lord repent that he
had made saul king over israel.

16:1 and the lord said unto samuel, how long wilt thou mourn for saul,
se I have reject him from reign over israel? fill thine horn
with oil, and go, I will send thee to jess the bethlehemite: for i
hav provid me a king among hi sons.

16:2 and samuel said, how can I go? if saul hear it, he will kill me.
and the lord said, take an heifer with thee, and say, I am come to
sacrific to the lord.

16:3 and call jess to the sacrifice, and I will shew thee what thou
shalt do: and thou shalt anoint unto me him whom I name unto thee.

16:4 and samuel did that which the lord spake, and came to bethlehem.
and the elder of the town trembl at hi coming, and said, comest
th peaceably?  16:5 and he said, peaceably: I am come to sacrifice
unto the lord: sanctifi yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice.
and he sanctifi jess and hi sons, and call them to the
sacrifice.

16:6 and it came to pass, when they were come, that he look on
eliab, and said, sure the lord' anoint is befor him.

16:7 but the lord said unto samuel, look not on hi countenance, or on
th height of hi stature; becaus I have refus him: for the lord
seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but
th lord looketh on the heart.

16:8 then jess call abinadab, and made him pass befor samuel. and
h said, neither hath the lord chosen this.

16:9 then jess made shammah to pass by. and he said, neither hath the
lord chosen this.

16:10 again, jess made seven of hi son to pass befor samuel. and
samuel said unto jesse, the lord hath not chosen these.

16:11 and samuel said unto jesse, are here all thi children? and he
said, there remaineth yet the youngest, and, behold, he keepeth the
sheep. and samuel said unto jesse, send and fetch him: for we will not
sit down till he come hither.

16:12 and he sent, and brought him in. now he wa ruddy, and withal of
a beauti countenance, and goodli to look to. and the lord said,
arise, anoint him: for thi is he.

16:13 then samuel took the horn of oil, and anoint him in the midst
of hi brethren: and the spirit of the lord came upon david from that
day forward. So samuel rose up, and went to ramah.

16:14 but the spirit of the lord depart from saul, and an evil
spirit from the lord troubl him.

16:15 and saul' servant said unto him, behold now, an evil spirit
from god troubleth thee.

16:16 let our lord now command thi servants, which are befor thee, to
seek out a man, who is a cun player on an harp: and it shall come
to pass, when the evil spirit from god is upon thee, that he shall
play with hi hand, and thou shalt be well.

16:17 and saul said unto hi servants, provid me now a man that can
play well, and bring him to me.

16:18 then answer one of the servants, and said, behold, I have seen
a son of jess the bethlehemite, that is cun in playing, and a
mighti valiant man, and a man of war, and prudent in matters, and a
com person, and the lord is with him.

16:19 wherefor saul sent messeng unto jesse, and said, send me
david thi son, which is with the sheep.

16:20 and jess took an ass laden with bread, and a bottl of wine,
and a kid, and sent them by david hi son unto saul.

16:21 and david came to saul, and stood befor him: and he love him
greatly; and he becam hi armourbearer.

16:22 and saul sent to jesse, saying, let david, I pray thee, stand
befor me; for he hath found favour in my sight.

16:23 and it came to pass, when the evil spirit from god wa upon
saul, that david took an harp, and play with hi hand: so saul was
refreshed, and wa well, and the evil spirit depart from him.

17:1 now the philistin gather togeth their armi to battle, and
wer gather togeth at shochoh, which belongeth to judah, and
pitch between shochoh and azekah, in ephesdammim.

17:2 and saul and the men of israel were gather together, and
pitch by the valley of elah, and set the battl in array against the
philistines.

17:3 and the philistin stood on a mountain on the one side, and
israel stood on a mountain on the other side: and there wa a valley
between them.

17:4 and there went out a champion out of the camp of the philistines,
nam goliath, of gath, whose height wa six cubit and a span.

17:5 and he had an helmet of brass upon hi head, and he wa armed
with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat wa five thousand
shekel of brass.

17:6 and he had greav of brass upon hi legs, and a target of brass
between hi shoulders.

17:7 and the staff of hi spear wa like a weaver' beam; and his
spear' head weigh six hundr shekel of iron: and one bear a
shield went befor him.

17:8 and he stood and cri unto the armi of israel, and said unto
them, whi are ye come out to set your battl in array? am not I a
philistine, and ye servant to saul? choos you a man for you, and let
him come down to me.

17:9 If he be abl to fight with me, and to kill me, then will we be
your servants: but if I prevail against him, and kill him, then shall
y be our servants, and serv us.

17:10 and the philistin said, I defi the armi of israel thi day;
giv me a man, that we may fight together.

17:11 when saul and all israel heard those word of the philistine,
they were dismayed, and greatli afraid.

17:12 now david wa the son of that ephrathit of bethlehemjudah,
whos name wa jesse; and he had eight sons: and the man went among
men for an old man in the day of saul.

17:13 and the three eldest son of jess went and follow saul to the
battle: and the name of hi three son that went to the battl were
eliab the firstborn, and next unto him abinadab, and the third
shammah.

17:14 and david wa the youngest: and the three eldest follow saul.

17:15 but david went and return from saul to feed hi father' sheep
at bethlehem.

17:16 and the philistin drew near morn and evening, and presented
himself forti days.

17:17 and jess said unto david hi son, take now for thi brethren an
ephah of thi parch corn, and these ten loaves, and run to the camp
of thi brethren; 17:18 and carri these ten chees unto the captain of
their thousand, and look how thi brethren fare, and take their pledge.

17:19 now saul, and they, and all the men of israel, were in the
valley of elah, fight with the philistines.

17:20 and david rose up earli in the morning, and left the sheep with
a keeper, and took, and went, as jess had command him; and he came
to the trench, as the host wa go forth to the fight, and shouted
for the battle.

17:21 for israel and the philistin had put the battl in array, army
against army.

17:22 and david left hi carriag in the hand of the keeper of the
carriage, and ran into the army, and came and salut hi brethren.

17:23 and as he talk with them, behold, there came up the champion,
th philistin of gath, goliath by name, out of the armi of the
philistines, and spake accord to the same words: and david heard
them.

17:24 and all the men of israel, when they saw the man, fled from him,
and were sore afraid.

17:25 and the men of israel said, have ye seen thi man that is come
up?  sure to defi israel is he come up: and it shall be, that the
man who killeth him, the king will enrich him with great riches, and
wil give him hi daughter, and make hi father' hous free in
israel.

17:26 and david spake to the men that stood by him, saying, what shall
b done to the man that killeth thi philistine, and taketh away the
reproach from israel? for who is thi uncircumcis philistine, that
h should defi the armi of the live god?  17:27 and the people
answ him after thi manner, saying, So shall it be done to the man
that killeth him.

17:28 and eliab hi eldest brother heard when he spake unto the men;
and eliab' anger wa kindl against david, and he said, whi camest
th down hither? and with whom hast thou left those few sheep in the
wilderness? I know thi pride, and the naughti of thine heart; for
thou art come down that thou mightest see the battle.

17:29 and david said, what have I now done? Is there not a cause?
17:30 and he turn from him toward another, and spake after the same
manner: and the peopl answer him again after the former manner.

17:31 and when the word were heard which david spake, they rehearsed
them befor saul: and he sent for him.

17:32 and david said to saul, let no man' heart fail becaus of him;
thi servant will go and fight with thi philistine.

17:33 and saul said to david, thou art not abl to go against this
philistin to fight with him: for thou art but a youth, and he a man
of war from hi youth.

17:34 and david said unto saul, thi servant kept hi father' sheep,
and there came a lion, and a bear, and took a lamb out of the flock:
17:35 and I went out after him, and smote him, and deliv it out of
hi mouth: and when he aros against me, I caught him by hi beard,
and smote him, and slew him.

17:36 thi servant slew both the lion and the bear: and this
uncircumcis philistin shall be as one of them, see he hath
defi the armi of the live god.

17:37 david said moreover, the lord that deliv me out of the paw
of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliv me out of
th hand of thi philistine. and saul said unto david, go, and the
lord be with thee.

17:38 and saul arm david with hi armour, and he put an helmet of
brass upon hi head; also he arm him with a coat of mail.

17:39 and david gird hi sword upon hi armour, and he assay to
go; for he had not prove it. and david said unto saul, I cannot go
with these; for I have not prove them. and david put them off him.

17:40 and he took hi staff in hi hand, and chose him five smooth
ston out of the brook, and put them in a shepherd' bag which he
had, even in a scrip; and hi sling wa in hi hand: and he drew near
to the philistine.

17:41 and the philistin came on and drew near unto david; and the man
that bare the shield went befor him.

17:42 and when the philistin look about, and saw david, he
disdain him: for he wa but a youth, and ruddy, and of a fair
countenance.

17:43 and the philistin said unto david, Am I a dog, that thou comest
to me with staves? and the philistin curs david by hi gods.

17:44 and the philistin said to david, come to me, and I will give
thi flesh unto the fowl of the air, and to the beast of the field.

17:45 then said david to the philistine, thou comest to me with a
sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the
nam of the lord of hosts, the god of the armi of israel, whom thou
hast defied.

17:46 thi day will the lord deliv thee into mine hand; and I will
smit thee, and take thine head from thee; and I will give the
carcas of the host of the philistin thi day unto the fowl of the
air, and to the wild beast of the earth; that all the earth may know
that there is a god in israel.

17:47 and all thi assembl shall know that the lord saveth not with
sword and spear: for the battl is the lord's, and he will give you
into our hands.

17:48 and it came to pass, when the philistin arose, and came, and
drew nigh to meet david, that david hastened, and ran toward the army
to meet the philistine.

17:49 and david put hi hand in hi bag, and took thenc a stone, and
slang it, and smote the philistin in hi forehead, that the stone
sunk into hi forehead; and he fell upon hi face to the earth.

17:50 So david prevail over the philistin with a sling and with a
stone, and smote the philistine, and slew him; but there wa no sword
in the hand of david.

17:51 therefor david ran, and stood upon the philistine, and took his
sword, and drew it out of the sheath thereof, and slew him, and cut
off hi head therewith. and when the philistin saw their champion
wa dead, they fled.

17:52 and the men of israel and of judah arose, and shouted, and
pursu the philistines, until thou come to the valley, and to the
gat of ekron.

and the wound of the philistin fell down by the way to shaaraim,
even unto gath, and unto ekron.

17:53 and the children of israel return from chase after the
philistines, and they spoil their tents.

17:54 and david took the head of the philistine, and brought it to
jerusalem; but he put hi armour in hi tent.

17:55 and when saul saw david go forth against the philistine, he said
unto abner, the captain of the host, abner, whose son is thi youth?
and abner said, As thi soul liveth, O king, I cannot tell.

17:56 and the king said, enquir thou whose son the stripl is.

17:57 and as david return from the slaughter of the philistine,
abn took him, and brought him befor saul with the head of the
philistin in hi hand.

17:58 and saul said to him, whose son art thou, thou young man? and
david answered, I am the son of thi servant jess the bethlehemite.

18:1 and it came to pass, when he had made an end of speak unto
saul, that the soul of jonathan wa knit with the soul of david, and
jonathan love him as hi own soul.

18:2 and saul took him that day, and would let him go no more home to
hi father' house.

18:3 then jonathan and david made a covenant, becaus he love him as
hi own soul.

18:4 and jonathan strip himself of the robe that wa upon him, and
gav it to david, and hi garments, even to hi sword, and to hi bow,
and to hi girdle.

18:5 and david went out whithersoev saul sent him, and behaved
himself wisely: and saul set him over the men of war, and he was
accept in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of
saul' servants.

18:6 and it came to pass as they came, when david wa return from
th slaughter of the philistine, that the women came out of all cities
of israel, sing and dancing, to meet king saul, with tabrets, with
joy, and with instrument of musick.

18:7 and the women answer one anoth as they played, and said, saul
hath slain hi thousands, and david hi ten thousands.

18:8 and saul wa veri wroth, and the say displeas him; and he
said, they have ascrib unto david ten thousands, and to me they have
ascrib but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?
18:9 and saul eye david from that day and forward.

18:10 and it came to pass on the morrow, that the evil spirit from god
cam upon saul, and he prophesi in the midst of the house: and david
play with hi hand, as at other times: and there wa a javelin in
saul' hand.

18:11 and saul cast the javelin; for he said, I will smite david even
to the wall with it. and david avoid out of hi presenc twice.

18:12 and saul wa afraid of david, becaus the lord wa with him, and
wa depart from saul.

18:13 therefor saul remov him from him, and made him hi captain
ov a thousand; and he went out and came in befor the people.

18:14 and david behav himself wise in all hi ways; and the lord
wa with him.

18:15 wherefor when saul saw that he behav himself veri wisely, he
wa afraid of him.

18:16 but all israel and judah love david, becaus he went out and
cam in befor them.

18:17 and saul said to david, behold my elder daughter merab, her will
i give thee to wife: onli be thou valiant for me, and fight the lord's
battles.

for saul said, let not mine hand be upon him, but let the hand of the
philistin be upon him.

18:18 and david said unto saul, who am I? and what is my life, or my
father' famili in israel, that I should be son in law to the king?
18:19 but it came to pass at the time when merab saul' daughter
should have been given to david, that she wa given unto adriel the
meholathit to wife.

18:20 and michal saul' daughter love david: and they told saul, and
th thing pleas him.

18:21 and saul said, I will give him her, that she may be a snare to
him, and that the hand of the philistin may be against him.
wherefor saul said to david, thou shalt thi day be my son in law in
th one of the twain.

18:22 and saul command hi servants, saying, commun with david
secretly, and say, behold, the king hath delight in thee, and all his
serv love thee: now therefor be the king' son in law.

18:23 and saul' servant spake those word in the ear of david. and
david said, seemeth it to you a light thing to be a king' son in law,
se that I am a poor man, and lightli esteemed?  18:24 and the
serv of saul told him, saying, On thi manner spake david.

18:25 and saul said, thu shall ye say to david, the king desireth not
ani dowry, but an hundr foreskin of the philistines, to be avenged
of the king' enemies. but saul thought to make david fall by the hand
of the philistines.

18:26 and when hi servant told david these words, it pleas david
wel to be the king' son in law: and the day were not expired.

18:27 wherefor david aros and went, he and hi men, and slew of the
philistin two hundr men; and david brought their foreskins, and
they gave them in full tale to the king, that he might be the king's
son in law. and saul gave him michal hi daughter to wife.

18:28 and saul saw and knew that the lord wa with david, and that
mich saul' daughter love him.

18:29 and saul wa yet the more afraid of david; and saul became
david' enemi continually.

18:30 then the princ of the philistin went forth: and it came to
pass, after they went forth, that david behav himself more wisely
than all the servant of saul; so that hi name wa much set by.

19:1 and saul spake to jonathan hi son, and to all hi servants, that
they should kill david.

19:2 but jonathan saul' son delight much in david: and jonathan
told david, saying, saul my father seeketh to kill thee: now
therefore, I pray thee, take heed to thyself until the morning, and
abid in a secret place, and hide thyself: 19:3 and I will go out and
stand besid my father in the field where thou art, and I will commune
with my father of thee; and what I see, that I will tell thee.

19:4 and jonathan spake good of david unto saul hi father, and said
unto him, let not the king sin against hi servant, against david;
becaus he hath not sin against thee, and becaus hi work have
been to thee-ward veri good: 19:5 for he did put hi life in hi hand,
and slew the philistine, and the lord wrought a great salvat for
al israel: thou sawest it, and didst rejoice: wherefor then wilt
thou sin against innoc blood, to slay david without a cause?  19:6
and saul hearken unto the voic of jonathan: and saul sware, As the
lord liveth, he shall not be slain.

19:7 and jonathan call david, and jonathan shew him all those
things.

and jonathan brought david to saul, and he wa in hi presence, as in
tim past.

19:8 and there wa war again: and david went out, and fought with the
philistines, and slew them with a great slaughter; and they fled from
him.

19:9 and the evil spirit from the lord wa upon saul, as he sat in his
hous with hi javelin in hi hand: and david play with hi hand.

19:10 and saul sought to smite david even to the wall with the
javelin: but he slip away out of saul' presence, and he smote the
javelin into the wall: and david fled, and escap that night.

19:11 saul also sent messeng unto david' house, to watch him, and
to slay him in the morning: and michal david' wife told him, saying,
if thou save not thi life to night, to morrow thou shalt be slain.

19:12 So michal let david down through a window: and he went, and
fled, and escaped.

19:13 and michal took an image, and laid it in the bed, and put a
pillow of goats' hair for hi bolster, and cover it with a cloth.

19:14 and when saul sent messeng to take david, she said, He is
sick.

19:15 and saul sent the messeng again to see david, saying, bring
him up to me in the bed, that I may slay him.

19:16 and when the messeng were come in, behold, there wa an image
in the bed, with a pillow of goats' hair for hi bolster.

19:17 and saul said unto michal, whi hast thou deceiv me so, and
