sent away mine enemy, that he is escaped? and michal answer saul, he
said unto me, let me go; whi should I kill thee?  19:18 So david fled,
and escaped, and came to samuel to ramah, and told him all that saul
had done to him. and he and samuel went and dwelt in naioth.

19:19 and it wa told saul, saying, behold, david is at naioth in
ramah.

19:20 and saul sent messeng to take david: and when they saw the
compani of the prophet prophesying, and samuel stand as appointed
ov them, the spirit of god wa upon the messeng of saul, and they
also prophesied.

19:21 and when it wa told saul, he sent other messengers, and they
prophesi likewise. and saul sent messeng again the third time,
and they prophesi also.

19:22 then went he also to ramah, and came to a great well that is in
sechu: and he ask and said, where are samuel and david? and one
said, behold, they be at naioth in ramah.

19:23 and he went thither to naioth in ramah: and the spirit of god
wa upon him also, and he went on, and prophesied, until he came to
naioth in ramah.

19:24 and he strip off hi cloth also, and prophesi before
samuel in like manner, and lay down nake all that day and all that
night. wherefor they say, Is saul also among the prophets?  20:1 and
david fled from naioth in ramah, and came and said befor jonathan,
what have I done? what is mine iniquity? and what is my sin befor thy
father, that he seeketh my life?  20:2 and he said unto him, god
forbid; thou shalt not die: behold, my father will do noth either
great or small, but that he will shew it me: and whi should my father
hid thi thing from me? it is not so.

20:3 and david sware moreover, and said, thi father certainli knoweth
that I have found grace in thine eyes; and he saith, let not jonathan
know this, lest he be grieved: but truli as the lord liveth, and as
thi soul liveth, there is but a step between me and death.

20:4 then said jonathan unto david, whatsoev thi soul desireth, i
wil even do it for thee.

20:5 and david said unto jonathan, behold, to morrow is the new moon,
and I should not fail to sit with the king at meat: but let me go,
that I may hide myself in the field unto the third day at even.

20:6 If thi father at all miss me, then say, david earnestli asked
leav of me that he might run to bethlehem hi city: for there is a
yearli sacrific there for all the family.

20:7 If he say thus, It is well; thi servant shall have peace: but if
h be veri wroth, then be sure that evil is determin by him.

20:8 therefor thou shalt deal kindli with thi servant; for thou hast
brought thi servant into a coven of the lord with thee:
notwithstanding, if there be in me iniquity, slay me thyself; for why
shouldest thou bring me to thi father?  20:9 and jonathan said, far be
it from thee: for if I knew certainli that evil were determin by my
fath to come upon thee, then would not I tell it thee?  20:10 then
said david to jonathan, who shall tell me? or what if thi father
answ thee roughly?  20:11 and jonathan said unto david, come, and
let us go out into the field. and they went out both of them into the
field.

20:12 and jonathan said unto david, O lord god of israel, when I have
sound my father about to morrow ani time, or the third day, and,
behold, if there be good toward david, and I then send not unto thee,
and shew it thee; 20:13 the lord do so and much more to jonathan: but
if it pleas my father to do thee evil, then I will shew it thee, and
send thee away, that thou mayest go in peace: and the lord be with
thee, as he hath been with my father.

20:14 and thou shalt not onli while yet I live shew me the kind of
th lord, that I die not: 20:15 but also thou shalt not cut off thy
kind from my hous for ever: no, not when the lord hath cut off
th enemi of david everi one from the face of the earth.

20:16 So jonathan made a coven with the hous of david, saying, let
th lord even requir it at the hand of david' enemies.

20:17 and jonathan caus david to swear again, becaus he love him:
for he love him as he love hi own soul.

20:18 then jonathan said to david, To morrow is the new moon: and thou
shalt be missed, becaus thi seat will be empty.

20:19 and when thou hast stay three days, then thou shalt go down
quickly, and come to the place where thou didst hide thyself when the
busi wa in hand, and shalt remain by the stone ezel.

20:20 and I will shoot three arrow on the side thereof, as though i
shot at a mark.

20:21 and, behold, I will send a lad, saying, go, find out the arrows.
if I expressli say unto the lad, behold, the arrow are on thi side
of thee, take them; then come thou: for there is peac to thee, and no
hurt; as the lord liveth.

20:22 but if I say thu unto the young man, behold, the arrow are
beyond thee; go thi way: for the lord hath sent thee away.

20:23 and as touch the matter which thou and I have spoken of,
behold, the lord be between thee and me for ever.

20:24 So david hid himself in the field: and when the new moon was
come, the king sat him down to eat meat.

20:25 and the king sat upon hi seat, as at other times, even upon a
seat by the wall: and jonathan arose, and abner sat by saul' side,
and david' place wa empty.

20:26 nevertheless saul spake not ani thing that day: for he thought,
someth hath befallen him, he is not clean; sure he is not clean.

20:27 and it came to pass on the morrow, which wa the second day of
th month, that david' place wa empty: and saul said unto jonathan
hi son, wherefor cometh not the son of jess to meat, neither
yesterday, nor to day?  20:28 and jonathan answer saul, david
earnestli ask leav of me to go to bethlehem: 20:29 and he said, let
m go, I pray thee; for our famili hath a sacrific in the city; and
mi brother, he hath command me to be there: and now, if I have found
favour in thine eyes, let me get away, I pray thee, and see my
brethren. therefor he cometh not unto the king' table.

20:30 then saul' anger wa kindl against jonathan, and he said unto
him, thou son of the pervers rebelli woman, do not I know that
thou hast chosen the son of jess to thine own confusion, and unto the
confus of thi mother' nakedness?  20:31 for as long as the son of
jess liveth upon the ground, thou shalt not be established, nor thy
kingdom. wherefor now send and fetch him unto me, for he shall surely
die.

20:32 and jonathan answer saul hi father, and said unto him,
wherefor shall he be slain? what hath he done?  20:33 and saul cast a
javelin at him to smite him: wherebi jonathan knew that it was
determin of hi father to slay david.

20:34 So jonathan aros from the tabl in fierc anger, and did eat no
meat the second day of the month: for he wa griev for david,
becaus hi father had done him shame.

20:35 and it came to pass in the morning, that jonathan went out into
th field at the time appoint with david, and a littl lad with him.

20:36 and he said unto hi lad, run, find out now the arrow which i
shoot. and as the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.

20:37 and when the lad wa come to the place of the arrow which
jonathan had shot, jonathan cri after the lad, and said, Is not the
arrow beyond thee?  20:38 and jonathan cri after the lad, make
speed, haste, stay not. and jonathan' lad gather up the arrows, and
cam to hi master.

20:39 but the lad knew not ani thing: onli jonathan and david knew the
matter.

20:40 and jonathan gave hi artilleri unto hi lad, and said unto him,
go, carri them to the city.

20:41 and as soon as the lad wa gone, david aros out of a place
toward the south, and fell on hi face to the ground, and bowed
himself three times: and they kiss one another, and wept one with
another, until david exceeded.

20:42 and jonathan said to david, Go in peace, forasmuch as we have
sworn both of us in the name of the lord, saying, the lord be between
m and thee, and between my seed and thi seed for ever. and he arose
and departed: and jonathan went into the city.

21:1 then came david to nob to ahimelech the priest: and ahimelech was
afraid at the meet of david, and said unto him, whi art thou alone,
and no man with thee?  21:2 and david said unto ahimelech the priest,
th king hath command me a business, and hath said unto me, let no
man know ani thing of the busi whereabout I send thee, and what i
hav command thee: and I have appoint my servant to such and such
a place.

21:3 now therefor what is under thine hand? give me five loav of
bread in mine hand, or what there is present.

21:4 and the priest answer david, and said, there is no common bread
und mine hand, but there is hallow bread; if the young men have
kept themselv at least from women.

21:5 and david answer the priest, and said unto him, Of a truth
women have been kept from us about these three days, sinc I came out,
and the vessel of the young men are holy, and the bread is in a
mann common, yea, though it were sanctifi thi day in the vessel.

21:6 So the priest gave him hallow bread: for there wa no bread
ther but the shewbread, that wa taken from befor the lord, to put
hot bread in the day when it wa taken away.

21:7 now a certain man of the servant of saul wa there that day,
detain befor the lord; and hi name wa doeg, an edomite, the
chiefest of the herdmen that belong to saul.

21:8 and david said unto ahimelech, and is there not here under thine
hand spear or sword? for I have neither brought my sword nor my
weapon with me, becaus the king' busi requir haste.

21:9 and the priest said, the sword of goliath the philistine, whom
thou slewest in the valley of elah, behold, it is here wrap in a
cloth behind the ephod: if thou wilt take that, take it: for there is
no other save that here. and david said, there is none like that; give
it me.

21:10 and david aros and fled that day for fear of saul, and went to
achish the king of gath.

21:11 and the servant of achish said unto him, Is not thi david the
k of the land? did they not sing one to anoth of him in dances,
saying, saul hath slain hi thousands, and david hi ten thousands?
21:12 and david laid up these word in hi heart, and wa sore afraid
of achish the king of gath.

21:13 and he chang hi behaviour befor them, and feign himself
mad in their hands, and scrabbl on the door of the gate, and let
hi spittl fall down upon hi beard.

21:14 then said achish unto hi servants, lo, ye see the man is mad:
wherefor then have ye brought him to me?  21:15 have I need of mad
men, that ye have brought thi fellow to play the mad man in my
presence? shall thi fellow come into my house?  22:1 david therefore
depart thence, and escap to the cave adullam: and when his
brethren and all hi father' hous heard it, they went down thither
to him.

22:2 and everi one that wa in distress, and everi one that wa in
debt, and everi one that wa discontented, gather themselv unto
him; and he becam a captain over them: and there were with him about
four hundr men.

22:3 and david went thenc to mizpeh of moab: and he said unto the
k of moab, let my father and my mother, I pray thee, come forth,
and be with you, till I know what god will do for me.

22:4 and he brought them befor the king of moab: and they dwelt with
him all the while that david wa in the hold.

22:5 and the prophet gad said unto david, abid not in the hold;
depart, and get thee into the land of judah. then david departed, and
cam into the forest of hareth.

22:6 when saul heard that david wa discovered, and the men that were
with him, (now saul abod in gibeah under a tree in ramah, have his
spear in hi hand, and all hi servant were stand about him;) 22:7
then saul said unto hi servant that stood about him, hear now, ye
benjamites; will the son of jess give everi one of you field and
vineyards, and make you all captain of thousands, and captain of
hundreds; 22:8 that all of you have conspir against me, and there is
non that sheweth me that my son hath made a leagu with the son of
jesse, and there is none of you that is sorri for me, or sheweth unto
m that my son hath stir up my servant against me, to lie in wait,
a at thi day?  22:9 then answer doeg the edomite, which wa set
ov the servant of saul, and said, I saw the son of jess come to
nob, to ahimelech the son of ahitub.

22:10 and he enquir of the lord for him, and gave him victuals, and
gav him the sword of goliath the philistine.

22:11 then the king sent to call ahimelech the priest, the son of
ahitub, and all hi father' house, the priest that were in nob: and
they came all of them to the king.

22:12 and saul said, hear now, thou son of ahitub. and he answered,
her I am, my lord.

22:13 and saul said unto him, whi have ye conspir against me, thou
and the son of jesse, in that thou hast given him bread, and a sword,
and hast enquir of god for him, that he should rise against me, to
li in wait, as at thi day?  22:14 then ahimelech answer the king,
and said, and who is so faith among all thi servant as david,
which is the king' son in law, and goeth at thi bidding, and is
honour in thine house?  22:15 did I then begin to enquir of god
for him? be it far from me: let not the king imput ani thing unto his
servant, nor to all the hous of my father: for thi servant knew
noth of all this, less or more.

22:16 and the king said, thou shalt sure die, ahimelech, thou, and
al thi father' house.

22:17 and the king said unto the footmen that stood about him, turn,
and slay the priest of the lord: becaus their hand also is with
david, and becaus they knew when he fled, and did not shew it to me.
but the servant of the king would not put forth their hand to fall
upon the priest of the lord.

22:18 and the king said to doeg, turn thou, and fall upon the priests.
and doeg the edomit turned, and he fell upon the priests, and slew on
that day fourscor and five person that did wear a linen ephod.

22:19 and nob, the citi of the priests, smote he with the edg of the
sword, both men and women, children and sucklings, and oxen, and
asses, and sheep, with the edg of the sword.

22:20 and one of the son of ahimelech the son of ahitub, named
abiathar, escaped, and fled after david.

22:21 and abiathar shew david that saul had slain the lord's
priests.

22:22 and david said unto abiathar, I knew it that day, when doeg the
edomit wa there, that he would sure tell saul: I have occasioned
th death of all the person of thi father' house.

22:23 abid thou with me, fear not: for he that seeketh my life
seeketh thi life: but with me thou shalt be in safeguard.

23:1 then they told david, saying, behold, the philistin fight
against keilah, and they rob the threshingfloors.

23:2 therefor david enquir of the lord, saying, shall I go and
smit these philistines? and the lord said unto david, go, and smite
th philistines, and save keilah.

23:3 and david' men said unto him, behold, we be afraid here in
judah: how much more then if we come to keilah against the armi of
th philistines?  23:4 then david enquir of the lord yet again. and
th lord answer him and said, arise, go down to keilah; for I will
deliv the philistin into thine hand.

23:5 So david and hi men went to keilah, and fought with the
philistines, and brought away their cattle, and smote them with a
great slaughter. So david save the inhabit of keilah.

23:6 and it came to pass, when abiathar the son of ahimelech fled to
david to keilah, that he came down with an ephod in hi hand.

23:7 and it wa told saul that david wa come to keilah. and saul
said, god hath deliv him into mine hand; for he is shut in, by
ent into a town that hath gate and bars.

23:8 and saul call all the peopl togeth to war, to go down to
keilah, to besieg david and hi men.

23:9 and david knew that saul secretli practis mischief against him;
and he said to abiathar the priest, bring hither the ephod.

23:10 then said david, O lord god of israel, thi servant hath
certainli heard that saul seeketh to come to keilah, to destroy the
citi for my sake.

23:11 will the men of keilah deliv me up into hi hand? will saul
com down, as thi servant hath heard? O lord god of israel, I beseech
thee, tell thi servant. and the lord said, He will come down.

23:12 then said david, will the men of keilah deliv me and my men
into the hand of saul? and the lord said, they will deliv thee up.

23:13 then david and hi men, which were about six hundred, aros and
depart out of keilah, and went whithersoev they could go. and it
wa told saul that david wa escap from keilah; and he forbar to go
forth.

23:14 and david abod in the wilder in strong holds, and remained
in a mountain in the wilder of ziph. and saul sought him every
day, but god deliv him not into hi hand.

23:15 and david saw that saul wa come out to seek hi life: and david
wa in the wilder of ziph in a wood.

23:16 and jonathan saul' son arose, and went to david into the wood,
and strengthen hi hand in god.

23:17 and he said unto him, fear not: for the hand of saul my father
shal not find thee; and thou shalt be king over israel, and I shall
b next unto thee; and that also saul my father knoweth.

23:18 and they two made a coven befor the lord: and david abod in
th wood, and jonathan went to hi house.

23:19 then came up the ziphit to saul to gibeah, saying, doth not
david hide himself with us in strong hold in the wood, in the hill of
hachilah, which is on the south of jeshimon?  23:20 now therefore, o
king, come down accord to all the desir of thi soul to come down;
and our part shall be to deliv him into the king' hand.

23:21 and saul said, bless be ye of the lord; for ye have compassion
on me.

23:22 go, I pray you, prepar yet, and know and see hi place where
hi haunt is, and who hath seen him there: for it is told me that he
dealeth veri subtilly.

23:23 see therefore, and take knowledg of all the lurk places
wher he hideth himself, and come ye again to me with the certainty,
and I will go with you: and it shall come to pass, if he be in the
land, that I will search him out throughout all the thousand of
judah.

23:24 and they arose, and went to ziph befor saul: but david and his
men were in the wilder of maon, in the plain on the south of
jeshimon.

23:25 saul also and hi men went to seek him. and they told david;
wherefor he came down into a rock, and abod in the wilder of
maon. and when saul heard that, he pursu after david in the
wild of maon.

23:26 and saul went on thi side of the mountain, and david and his
men on that side of the mountain: and david made hast to get away for
fear of saul; for saul and hi men compass david and hi men round
about to take them.

23:27 but there came a messeng unto saul, saying, hast thee, and
come; for the philistin have invad the land.

23:28 wherefor saul return from pursu after david, and went
against the philistines: therefor they call that place
selahammahlekoth.

23:29 and david went up from thence, and dwelt in strong hold at
engedi.

24:1 and it came to pass, when saul wa return from follow the
philistines, that it wa told him, saying, behold, david is in the
wild of engedi.

24:2 then saul took three thousand chosen men out of all israel, and
went to seek david and hi men upon the rock of the wild goats.

24:3 and he came to the sheepcot by the way, where wa a cave; and
saul went in to cover hi feet: and david and hi men remain in the
sid of the cave.

24:4 and the men of david said unto him, behold the day of which the
lord said unto thee, behold, I will deliv thine enemi into thine
hand, that thou mayest do to him as it shall seem good unto thee. then
david arose, and cut off the skirt of saul' robe privily.

24:5 and it came to pass afterward, that david' heart smote him,
becaus he had cut off saul' skirt.

24:6 and he said unto hi men, the lord forbid that I should do this
th unto my master, the lord' anointed, to stretch forth mine hand
against him, see he is the anoint of the lord.

24:7 So david stay hi servant with these words, and suffer them
not to rise against saul. but saul rose up out of the cave, and went
on hi way.

24:8 david also aros afterward, and went out of the cave, and cried
aft saul, saying, My lord the king. and when saul look behind him,
david stoop with hi face to the earth, and bow himself.

24:9 and david said to saul, wherefor hearest thou men' words,
saying, behold, david seeketh thi hurt?  24:10 behold, thi day thine
ey have seen how that the lord had deliv thee to day into mine
hand in the cave: and some bade me kill thee: but mine eye spared
thee; and I said, I will not put forth mine hand against my lord; for
h is the lord' anointed.

24:11 moreover, my father, see, yea, see the skirt of thi robe in my
hand: for in that I cut off the skirt of thi robe, and kill thee
not, know thou and see that there is neither evil nor transgress in
min hand, and I have not sin against thee; yet thou huntest my
soul to take it.

24:12 the lord judg between me and thee, and the lord aveng me of
thee: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.

24:13 As saith the proverb of the ancients, wicked proceedeth from
th wicked: but mine hand shall not be upon thee.

24:14 after whom is the king of israel come out? after whom dost thou
pursue? after a dead dog, after a flea.

24:15 the lord therefor be judge, and judg between me and thee, and
see, and plead my cause, and deliv me out of thine hand.

24:16 and it came to pass, when david had made an end of speaking
thes word unto saul, that saul said, Is thi thi voice, my son
david? and saul lift up hi voice, and wept.

24:17 and he said to david, thou art more righteou than I: for thou
hast reward me good, wherea I have reward thee evil.

24:18 and thou hast shew thi day how that thou hast dealt well with
me: forasmuch as when the lord had deliv me into thine hand, thou
killedst me not.

24:19 for if a man find hi enemy, will he let him go well away?
wherefor the lord reward thee good for that thou hast done unto me
thi day.

24:20 and now, behold, I know well that thou shalt sure be king, and
that the kingdom of israel shall be establish in thine hand.

24:21 swear now therefor unto me by the lord, that thou wilt not cut
off my seed after me, and that thou wilt not destroy my name out of my
father' house.

24:22 and david sware unto saul. and saul went home; but david and his
men gat them up unto the hold.

25:1 and samuel died; and all the israelit were gather together,
and lament him, and buri him in hi hous at ramah. and david
arose, and went down to the wilder of paran.

25:2 and there wa a man in maon, whose possess were in carmel;
and the man wa veri great, and he had three thousand sheep, and a
thousand goats: and he wa shear hi sheep in carmel.

25:3 now the name of the man wa nabal; and the name of hi wife
abigail: and she wa a woman of good understanding, and of a beautiful
countenance: but the man wa churlish and evil in hi doings; and he
wa of the hous of caleb.

25:4 and david heard in the wilder that nabal did shear hi sheep.

25:5 and david sent out ten young men, and david said unto the young
men, get you up to carmel, and go to nabal, and greet him in my name:
25:6 and thu shall ye say to him that liveth in prosperity, peac be
both to thee, and peac be to thine house, and peac be unto all that
thou hast.

25:7 and now I have heard that thou hast shearers: now thi shepherds
which were with us, we hurt them not, neither wa there ought missing
unto them, all the while they were in carmel.

25:8 ask thi young men, and they will shew thee. wherefor let the
young men find favour in thine eyes: for we come in a good day: give,
i pray thee, whatsoev cometh to thine hand unto thi servants, and to
thi son david.

25:9 and when david' young men came, they spake to nabal accord to
al those word in the name of david, and ceased.

25:10 and nabal answer david' servants, and said, who is david? and
who is the son of jesse? there be mani servant now a day that break
away everi man from hi master.

25:11 shall I then take my bread, and my water, and my flesh that i
hav kill for my shearers, and give it unto men, whom I know not
whenc they be?  25:12 So david' young men turn their way, and went
again, and came and told him all those sayings.

25:13 and david said unto hi men, gird ye on everi man hi sword. and
they gird on everi man hi sword; and david also gird on his
sword: and there went up after david about four hundr men; and two
hundr abod by the stuff.

25:14 but one of the young men told abigail, nabal' wife, saying,
behold, david sent messeng out of the wilder to salut our
master; and he rail on them.

25:15 but the men were veri good unto us, and we were not hurt,
neith miss we ani thing, as long as we were convers with them,
when we were in the fields: 25:16 they were a wall unto us both by
night and day, all the while we were with them keep the sheep.

25:17 now therefor know and consid what thou wilt do; for evil is
determin against our master, and against all hi household: for he
i such a son of belial, that a man cannot speak to him.

25:18 then abigail made haste, and took two hundr loaves, and two
bottl of wine, and five sheep readi dressed, and five measur of
parch corn, and an hundr cluster of raisins, and two hundred
cak of figs, and laid them on asses.

25:19 and she said unto her servants, Go on befor me; behold, I come
aft you. but she told not her husband nabal.

25:20 and it wa so, as she rode on the ass, that she came down by the
covert on the hill, and, behold, david and hi men came down against
her; and she met them.

25:21 now david had said, sure in vain have I kept all that this
fellow hath in the wilderness, so that noth wa miss of all that
pertain unto him: and he hath requit me evil for good.

25:22 So and more also do god unto the enemi of david, if I leav of
al that pertain to him by the morn light ani that pisseth against
th wall.

25:23 and when abigail saw david, she hasted, and light off the ass,
and fell befor david on her face, and bow herself to the ground,
25:24 and fell at hi feet, and said, upon me, my lord, upon me let
thi iniqu be: and let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak in thine
audience, and hear the word of thine handmaid.

25:25 let not my lord, I pray thee, regard thi man of belial, even
nabal: for as hi name is, so is he; nabal is hi name, and folli is
with him: but I thine handmaid saw not the young men of my lord, whom
thou didst send.

25:26 now therefore, my lord, as the lord liveth, and as thi soul
liveth, see the lord hath withholden thee from come to shed
blood, and from aveng thyself with thine own hand, now let thine
enemies, and they that seek evil to my lord, be as nabal.

25:27 and now thi bless which thine handmaid hath brought unto my
lord, let it even be given unto the young men that follow my lord.

25:28 I pray thee, forgiv the trespass of thine handmaid: for the
lord will certainli make my lord a sure house; becaus my lord
fighteth the battl of the lord, and evil hath not been found in thee
al thi days.

25:29 yet a man is risen to pursu thee, and to seek thi soul: but the
soul of my lord shall be bound in the bundl of life with the lord thy
god; and the soul of thine enemies, them shall he sling out, as out
of the middl of a sling.

25:30 and it shall come to pass, when the lord shall have done to my
lord accord to all the good that he hath spoken concern thee,
and shall have appoint thee ruler over israel; 25:31 that thi shall
b no grief unto thee, nor offenc of heart unto my lord, either that
thou hast shed blood causeless, or that my lord hath aveng himself:
but when the lord shall have dealt well with my lord, then remember
thin handmaid.

25:32 and david said to abigail, bless be the lord god of israel,
which sent thee thi day to meet me: 25:33 and bless be thi advice,
and bless be thou, which hast kept me thi day from come to shed
blood, and from aveng myself with mine own hand.

25:34 for in veri deed, as the lord god of israel liveth, which hath
kept me back from hurt thee, except thou hadst hast and come to
meet me, sure there had not been left unto nabal by the morning
light ani that pisseth against the wall.

25:35 So david receiv of her hand that which she had brought him,
and said unto her, Go up in peac to thine house; see, I have
hearken to thi voice, and have accept thi person.

25:36 and abigail came to nabal; and, behold, he held a feast in his
house, like the feast of a king; and nabal' heart wa merri within
him, for he wa veri drunken: wherefor she told him nothing, less or
more, until the morn light.

25:37 but it came to pass in the morning, when the wine wa gone out
of nabal, and hi wife had told him these things, that hi heart died
within him, and he becam as a stone.

25:38 and it came to pass about ten day after, that the lord smote
nabal, that he died.

25:39 and when david heard that nabal wa dead, he said, bless be
th lord, that hath plead the caus of my reproach from the hand of
nabal, and hath kept hi servant from evil: for the lord hath returned
th wicked of nabal upon hi own head. and david sent and communed
with abigail, to take her to him to wife.

25:40 and when the servant of david were come to abigail to carmel,
they spake unto her, saying, david sent us unto thee, to take thee to
him to wife.

25:41 and she arose, and bow herself on her face to the earth, and
said, behold, let thine handmaid be a servant to wash the feet of the
serv of my lord.

25:42 and abigail hasted, and aros and rode upon an ass, with five
damsel of her that went after her; and she went after the messengers
of david, and becam hi wife.

25:43 david also took ahinoam of jezreel; and they were also both of
them hi wives.

25:44 but saul had given michal hi daughter, david' wife, to phalti
th son of laish, which wa of gallim.

26:1 and the ziphit came unto saul to gibeah, saying, doth not david
hid himself in the hill of hachilah, which is befor jeshimon?  26:2
then saul arose, and went down to the wilder of ziph, have three
thousand chosen men of israel with him, to seek david in the
wild of ziph.

26:3 and saul pitch in the hill of hachilah, which is before
jeshimon, by the way. but david abod in the wilderness, and he saw
that saul came after him into the wilderness.

26:4 david therefor sent out spies, and understood that saul wa come
in veri deed.

26:5 and david arose, and came to the place where saul had pitched:
and david beheld the place where saul lay, and abner the son of ner,
th captain of hi host: and saul lay in the trench, and the people
pitch round about him.

26:6 then answer david and said to ahimelech the hittite, and to
abishai the son of zeruiah, brother to joab, saying, who will go down
with me to saul to the camp? and abishai said, I will go down with
thee.

26:7 So david and abishai came to the peopl by night: and, behold,
saul lay sleep within the trench, and hi spear stuck in the ground
at hi bolster: but abner and the peopl lay round about him.

26:8 then said abishai to david, god hath deliv thine enemi into
thin hand thi day: now therefor let me smite him, I pray thee, with
th spear even to the earth at once, and I will not smite him the
second time.

26:9 and david said to abishai, destroy him not: for who can stretch
forth hi hand against the lord' anointed, and be guiltless?  26:10
david said furthermore, As the lord liveth, the lord shall smite him;
or hi day shall come to die; or he shall descend into battle, and
perish.

26:11 the lord forbid that I should stretch forth mine hand against
th lord' anointed: but, I pray thee, take thou now the spear that is
at hi bolster, and the cruse of water, and let us go.

26:12 So david took the spear and the cruse of water from saul's
bolster; and they gat them away, and no man saw it, nor knew it,
neith awaked: for they were all asleep; becaus a deep sleep from
th lord wa fallen upon them.

26:13 then david went over to the other side, and stood on the top of
an hill afar off; a great space be between them: 26:14 and david
cri to the people, and to abner the son of ner, saying, answerest
th not, abner? then abner answer and said, who art thou that
criest to the king?  26:15 and david said to abner, art not thou a
vali man? and who is like to thee in israel? wherefor then hast
thou not kept thi lord the king? for there came one of the peopl in
to destroy the king thi lord.

26:16 thi thing is not good that thou hast done. As the lord liveth,
y are worthi to die, becaus ye have not kept your master, the lord's
anointed.

and now see where the king' spear is, and the cruse of water that was
at hi bolster.

26:17 and saul knew david' voice, and said, Is thi thi voice, my son
david? and david said, It is my voice, my lord, O king.

26:18 and he said, wherefor doth my lord thu pursu after his
servant?  for what have I done? or what evil is in mine hand?  26:19
now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord the king hear the word of his
servant. If the lord have stir thee up against me, let him accept
an offering: but if they be the children of men, curs be they before
th lord; for they have driven me out thi day from abid in the
inherit of the lord, saying, go, serv other gods.

26:20 now therefore, let not my blood fall to the earth befor the
fac of the lord: for the king of israel is come out to seek a flea,
a when one doth hunt a partridg in the mountains.

26:21 then said saul, I have sinned: return, my son david: for I will
no more do thee harm, becaus my soul wa preciou in thine eye this
day: behold, I have play the fool, and have er exceedingly.

26:22 and david answer and said, behold the king' spear! and let
on of the young men come over and fetch it.

26:23 the lord render to everi man hi righteous and his
faithfulness; for the lord deliv thee into my hand to day, but i
would not stretch forth mine hand against the lord' anointed.

26:24 and, behold, as thi life wa much set by thi day in mine eyes,
so let my life be much set by in the eye of the lord, and let him
deliv me out of all tribulation.

26:25 then saul said to david, bless be thou, my son david: thou
shalt both do great things, and also shalt still prevail. So david
w on hi way, and saul return to hi place.

27:1 and david said in hi heart, I shall now perish one day by the
hand of saul: there is noth better for me than that I should
speedili escap into the land of the philistines; and saul shall
despair of me, to seek me ani more in ani coast of israel: so shall i
escap out of hi hand.

27:2 and david arose, and he pass over with the six hundr men that
wer with him unto achish, the son of maoch, king of gath.

27:3 and david dwelt with achish at gath, he and hi men, everi man
with hi household, even david with hi two wives, ahinoam the
jezreelitess, and abigail the carmelitess, nabal' wife.

27:4 and it wa told saul that david wa fled to gath: and he sought
no more again for him.

27:5 and david said unto achish, If I have now found grace in thine
eyes, let them give me a place in some town in the country, that I may
dwel there: for whi should thi servant dwell in the royal citi with
thee?  27:6 then achish gave him ziklag that day: wherefor ziklag
pertaineth unto the king of judah unto thi day.

27:7 and the time that david dwelt in the countri of the philistines
wa a full year and four months.

27:8 and david and hi men went up, and invad the geshurites, and
th gezrites, and the amalekites: for those nation were of old the
inhabit of the land, as thou goest to shur, even unto the land of
egypt.

27:9 and david smote the land, and left neither man nor woman alive,
and took away the sheep, and the oxen, and the asses, and the camels,
and the apparel, and returned, and came to achish.

27:10 and achish said, whither have ye made a road to day? and david
said, against the south of judah, and against the south of the
jerahmeelites, and against the south of the kenites.

27:11 and david save neither man nor woman alive, to bring tide to
gath, saying, lest they should tell on us, saying, So did david, and
so will be hi manner all the while he dwelleth in the countri of the
philistines.

27:12 and achish believ david, saying, He hath made hi people
israel utterli to abhor him; therefor he shall be my servant for
ever.

28:1 and it came to pass in those days, that the philistin gathered
their armi togeth for warfare, to fight with israel. and achish
said unto david, know thou assuredly, that thou shalt go out with me
to battle, thou and thi men.

28:2 and david said to achish, sure thou shalt know what thi servant
can do. and achish said to david, therefor will I make thee keeper of
min head for ever.

28:3 now samuel wa dead, and all israel had lament him, and buried
him in ramah, even in hi own city. and saul had put away those that
had familiar spirits, and the wizards, out of the land.

28:4 and the philistin gather themselv together, and came and
pitch in shunem: and saul gather all israel together, and they
pitch in gilboa.

28:5 and when saul saw the host of the philistines, he wa afraid, and
hi heart greatli trembled.

28:6 and when saul enquir of the lord, the lord answer him not,
neith by dreams, nor by urim, nor by prophets.

28:7 then said saul unto hi servants, seek me a woman that hath a
familiar spirit, that I may go to her, and enquir of her. and his
serv said to him, behold, there is a woman that hath a familiar
spirit at endor.

28:8 and saul disguis himself, and put on other raiment, and he
went, and two men with him, and they came to the woman by night: and
h said, I pray thee, divin unto me by the familiar spirit, and bring
m him up, whom I shall name unto thee.

28:9 and the woman said unto him, behold, thou knowest what saul hath
done, how he hath cut off those that have familiar spirits, and the
wizards, out of the land: wherefor then layest thou a snare for my
life, to caus me to die?  28:10 and saul sware to her by the lord,
saying, As the lord liveth, there shall no punish happen to thee
for thi thing.

28:11 then said the woman, whom shall I bring up unto thee? and he
said, bring me up samuel.

28:12 and when the woman saw samuel, she cri with a loud voice: and
th woman spake to saul, saying, whi hast thou deceiv me? for thou
art saul.

28:13 and the king said unto her, Be not afraid: for what sawest thou?
and the woman said unto saul, I saw god ascend out of the earth.

28:14 and he said unto her, what form is he of? and she said, An old
man cometh up; and he is cover with a mantle. and saul perceived
that it wa samuel, and he stoop with hi face to the ground, and
bow himself.

28:15 and samuel said to saul, whi hast thou disquiet me, to bring
m up? and saul answered, I am sore distressed; for the philistines
mak war against me, and god is depart from me, and answereth me no
more, neither by prophets, nor by dreams: therefor I have called
thee, that thou mayest make known unto me what I shall do.

28:16 then said samuel, wherefor then dost thou ask of me, see the
lord is depart from thee, and is becom thine enemy?  28:17 and the
lord hath done to him, as he spake by me: for the lord hath rent the
kingdom out of thine hand, and given it to thi neighbour, even to
david: 28:18 becaus thou obeyedst not the voic of the lord, nor
executedst hi fierc wrath upon amalek, therefor hath the lord done
thi thing unto thee thi day.

28:19 moreov the lord will also deliv israel with thee into the
hand of the philistines: and to morrow shalt thou and thi son be with
me: the lord also shall deliv the host of israel into the hand of
th philistines.

28:20 then saul fell straightway all along on the earth, and wa sore
afraid, becaus of the word of samuel: and there wa no strength in
him; for he had eaten no bread all the day, nor all the night.

28:21 and the woman came unto saul, and saw that he wa sore troubled,
and said unto him, behold, thine handmaid hath obey thi voice, and i
hav put my life in my hand, and have hearken unto thi word which
thou spakest unto me.

28:22 now therefore, I pray thee, hearken thou also unto the voic of
thin handmaid, and let me set a morsel of bread befor thee; and eat,
that thou mayest have strength, when thou goest on thi way.

28:23 but he refused, and said, I will not eat. but hi servants,
togeth with the woman, compel him; and he hearken unto their
voice. So he aros from the earth, and sat upon the bed.

28:24 and the woman had a fat calf in the house; and she hasted, and
kil it, and took flour, and knead it, and did bake unleavened
bread thereof: 28:25 and she brought it befor saul, and befor his
servants; and they did eat. then they rose up, and went away that
night.

29:1 now the philistin gather togeth all their armi to aphek:
and the israelit pitch by a fountain which is in jezreel.

29:2 and the lord of the philistin pass on by hundreds, and by
thousands: but david and hi men pass on in the rereward with
achish.

29:3 then said the princ of the philistines, what do these hebrews
here?  and achish said unto the princ of the philistines, Is not
thi david, the servant of saul the king of israel, which hath been
with me these days, or these years, and I have found no fault in him
sinc he fell unto me unto thi day?  29:4 and the princ of the
philistin were wroth with him; and the princ of the philistines
said unto him, make thi fellow return, that he may go again to his
plac which thou hast appoint him, and let him not go down with us
to battle, lest in the battl he be an adversari to us: for wherewith
should he reconcil himself unto hi master? should it not be with the
head of these men?  29:5 Is not thi david, of whom they sang one to
anoth in dances, saying, saul slew hi thousands, and david hi ten
thousands?  29:6 then achish call david, and said unto him, surely,
a the lord liveth, thou hast been upright, and thi go out and thy
com in with me in the host is good in my sight: for I have not
found evil in thee sinc the day of thi come unto me unto thi day:
nevertheless the lord favour thee not.

29:7 wherefor now return, and go in peace, that thou displeas not
th lord of the philistines.

29:8 and david said unto achish, but what have I done? and what hast
thou found in thi servant so long as I have been with thee unto this
day, that I may not go fight against the enemi of my lord the king?
29:9 and achish answer and said to david, I know that thou art good
in my sight, as an angel of god: notwithstand the princ of the
philistin have said, He shall not go up with us to the battle.

29:10 wherefor now rise up earli in the morn with thi master's
serv that are come with thee: and as soon as ye be up earli in the
morning, and have light, depart.

29:11 So david and hi men rose up earli to depart in the morning, to
return into the land of the philistines. and the philistin went up
to jezreel.

30:1 and it came to pass, when david and hi men were come to ziklag
on the third day, that the amalekit had invad the south, and
ziklag, and smitten ziklag, and burn it with fire; 30:2 and had
taken the women captives, that were therein: they slew not any, either
great or small, but carri them away, and went on their way.

30:3 So david and hi men came to the city, and, behold, it wa burned
with fire; and their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, were
taken captives.

30:4 then david and the peopl that were with him lift up their
voic and wept, until they had no more power to weep.

30:5 and david' two wive were taken captives, ahinoam the
jezreelitess, and abigail the wife of nabal the carmelite.

30:6 and david wa greatli distressed; for the peopl spake of stoning
him, becaus the soul of all the peopl wa grieved, everi man for his
son and for hi daughters: but david encourag himself in the lord
hi god.

30:7 and david said to abiathar the priest, ahimelech' son, I pray
thee, bring me hither the ephod. and abiathar brought thither the
ephod to david.

30:8 and david enquir at the lord, saying, shall I pursu after this
troop? shall I overtak them? and he answer him, pursue: for thou
shalt sure overtak them, and without fail recov all.

30:9 So david went, he and the six hundr men that were with him, and
cam to the brook besor, where those that were left behind stayed.

30:10 but david pursued, he and four hundr men: for two hundred
abod behind, which were so faint that they could not go over the
brook besor.

30:11 and they found an egyptian in the field, and brought him to
david, and gave him bread, and he did eat; and they made him drink
water; 30:12 and they gave him a piec of a cake of figs, and two
clust of raisins: and when he had eaten, hi spirit came again to
him: for he had eaten no bread, nor drunk ani water, three day and
thre nights.

30:13 and david said unto him, To whom belongest thou? and whenc art
thou? and he said, I am a young man of egypt, servant to an amalekite;
and my master left me, becaus three day agon I fell sick.

30:14 We made an invas upon the south of the cherethites, and upon
th coast which belongeth to judah, and upon the south of caleb; and
w burn ziklag with fire.

30:15 and david said to him, canst thou bring me down to thi company?
and he said, swear unto me by god, that thou wilt neither kill me, nor
deliv me into the hand of my master, and I will bring thee down to
thi company.

30:16 and when he had brought him down, behold, they were spread
abroad upon all the earth, eat and drinking, and dancing, because
of all the great spoil that they had taken out of the land of the
philistines, and out of the land of judah.

30:17 and david smote them from the twilight even unto the even of
th next day: and there escap not a man of them, save four hundred
young men, which rode upon camels, and fled.

30:18 and david recov all that the amalekit had carri away:
and david rescu hi two wives.

30:19 and there wa noth lack to them, neither small nor great,
neith son nor daughters, neither spoil, nor ani thing that they had
taken to them: david recov all.

30:20 and david took all the flock and the herds, which they drave
befor those other cattle, and said, thi is david' spoil.

30:21 and david came to the two hundr men, which were so faint that
they could not follow david, whom they had made also to abid at the
brook besor: and they went forth to meet david, and to meet the people
that were with him: and when david came near to the people, he saluted
them.

30:22 then answer all the wick men and men of belial, of those
that went with david, and said, becaus they went not with us, we will
not give them ought of the spoil that we have recovered, save to every
man hi wife and hi children, that they may lead them away, and
depart.

30:23 then said david, Ye shall not do so, my brethren, with that
which the lord hath given us, who hath preserv us, and deliv the
compani that came against us into our hand.

30:24 for who will hearken unto you in thi matter? but as hi part is
that goeth down to the battle, so shall hi part be that tarrieth by
th stuff: they shall part alike.

30:25 and it wa so from that day forward, that he made it a statute
and an ordin for israel unto thi day.

30:26 and when david came to ziklag, he sent of the spoil unto the
eld of judah, even to hi friends, saying, behold a present for you
of the spoil of the enemi of the lord; 30:27 To them which were in
bethel, and to them which were in south ramoth, and to them which were
in jattir, 30:28 and to them which were in aroer, and to them which
wer in siphmoth, and to them which were in eshtemoa, 30:29 and to
them which were in rachal, and to them which were in the citi of the
jerahmeelites, and to them which were in the citi of the kenites,
30:30 and to them which were in hormah, and to them which were in
chorashan, and to them which were in athach, 30:31 and to them which
wer in hebron, and to all the place where david himself and hi men
wer wont to haunt.

31:1 now the philistin fought against israel: and the men of israel
fl from befor the philistines, and fell down slain in mount gilboa.

31:2 and the philistin follow hard upon saul and upon hi sons;
and the philistin slew jonathan, and abinadab, and melchishua,
saul' sons.

31:3 and the battl went sore against saul, and the archer hit him;
and he wa sore wound of the archers.

31:4 then said saul unto hi armourbearer, draw thi sword, and thrust
m through therewith; lest these uncircumcis come and thrust me
through, and abus me. but hi armourbear would not; for he wa sore
afraid. therefor saul took a sword, and fell upon it.

31:5 and when hi armourbear saw that saul wa dead, he fell
likewis upon hi sword, and die with him.

31:6 So saul died, and hi three sons, and hi armourbearer, and all
hi men, that same day together.

31:7 and when the men of israel that were on the other side of the
valley, and they that were on the other side jordan, saw that the men
of israel fled, and that saul and hi son were dead, they forsook the
cities, and fled; and the philistin came and dwelt in them.

31:8 and it came to pass on the morrow, when the philistin came to
strip the slain, that they found saul and hi three son fallen in
mount gilboa.

31:9 and they cut off hi head, and strip off hi armour, and sent
into the land of the philistin round about, to publish it in the
hous of their idols, and among the people.

31:10 and they put hi armour in the hous of ashtaroth: and they
fasten hi bodi to the wall of bethshan.

31:11 and when the inhabit of jabeshgilead heard of that which the
philistin had done to saul; 31:12 all the valiant men arose, and
went all night, and took the bodi of saul and the bodi of hi sons
from the wall of bethshan, and came to jabesh, and burnt them there.

31:13 and they took their bones, and buri them under a tree at
jabesh, and fast seven days.




th second book of samuel

otherwis called:

th second book of the kings


1:1 now it came to pass after the death of saul, when david was
return from the slaughter of the amalekites, and david had abod two
day in ziklag; 1:2 It came even to pass on the third day, that,
behold, a man came out of the camp from saul with hi cloth rent,
and earth upon hi head: and so it was, when he came to david, that he
fel to the earth, and did obeisance.

1:3 and david said unto him, from whenc comest thou? and he said unto
him, out of the camp of israel am I escaped.

1:4 and david said unto him, how went the matter? I pray thee, tell
me.

and he answered, that the peopl are fled from the battle, and mani of
th peopl also are fallen and dead; and saul and jonathan hi son are
dead also.

1:5 and david said unto the young man that told him, how knowest thou
that saul and jonathan hi son be dead?  1:6 and the young man that
told him said, As I happen by chanc upon mount gilboa, behold, saul
lean upon hi spear; and, lo, the chariot and horsemen followed
hard after him.

1:7 and when he look behind him, he saw me, and call unto me. and
i answered, here am i.

1:8 and he said unto me, who art thou? and I answer him, I am an
amalekite.

1:9 He said unto me again, stand, I pray thee, upon me, and slay me:
for anguish is come upon me, becaus my life is yet whole in me.

1:10 So I stood upon him, and slew him, becaus I wa sure that he
could not live after that he wa fallen: and I took the crown that was
upon hi head, and the bracelet that wa on hi arm, and have brought
them hither unto my lord.

1:11 then david took hold on hi clothes, and rent them; and likewise
al the men that were with him: 1:12 and they mourned, and wept, and
fast until even, for saul, and for jonathan hi son, and for the
peopl of the lord, and for the hous of israel; becaus they were
fallen by the sword.

1:13 and david said unto the young man that told him, whenc art thou?
and he answered, I am the son of a stranger, an amalekite.

1:14 and david said unto him, how wast thou not afraid to stretch
forth thine hand to destroy the lord' anointed?  1:15 and david
cal one of the young men, and said, Go near, and fall upon him. and
h smote him that he died.

1:16 and david said unto him, thi blood be upon thi head; for thy
mouth hath testifi against thee, saying, I have slain the lord's
anointed.

1:17 and david lament with thi lament over saul and over
jonathan hi son: 1:18 (also he bade them teach the children of judah
th use of the bow: behold, it is written in the book of jasher.)
1:19 the beauti of israel is slain upon thi high places: how are the
mighti fallen!  1:20 tell it not in gath, publish it not in the
street of askelon; lest the daughter of the philistin rejoice,
lest the daughter of the uncircumcis triumph.

1:21 Ye mountain of gilboa, let there be no dew, neither let there be
rain, upon you, nor field of offerings: for there the shield of the
mighti is vile cast away, the shield of saul, as though he had not
been anoint with oil.

1:22 from the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow
of jonathan turn not back, and the sword of saul return not empty.

1:23 saul and jonathan were love and pleasant in their lives, and in
their death they were not divided: they were swifter than eagles, they
wer stronger than lions.

1:24 Ye daughter of israel, weep over saul, who cloth you in
scarlet, with other delights, who put on ornament of gold upon your
apparel.

1:25 how are the mighti fallen in the midst of the battle! O jonathan,
th wast slain in thine high places.

1:26 I am distress for thee, my brother jonathan: veri pleasant hast
thou been unto me: thi love to me wa wonderful, pass the love of
women.

1:27 how are the mighti fallen, and the weapon of war perished!  2:1
and it came to pass after this, that david enquir of the lord,
saying, shall I go up into ani of the citi of judah? and the lord
said unto him, Go up. and david said, whither shall I go up? and he
said, unto hebron.

2:2 So david went up thither, and hi two wive also, ahinoam the
jezreelitess, and abigail nabal' wife the carmelite.

2:3 and hi men that were with him did david bring up, everi man with
hi household: and they dwelt in the citi of hebron.

2:4 and the men of judah came, and there they anoint david king over
th hous of judah. and they told david, saying, that the men of
jabeshgilead were they that buri saul.

2:5 and david sent messeng unto the men of jabeshgilead, and said
unto them, bless be ye of the lord, that ye have shew this
kind unto your lord, even unto saul, and have buri him.

2:6 and now the lord shew kind and truth unto you: and I also will
requit you thi kindness, becaus ye have done thi thing.

2:7 therefor now let your hand be strengthened, and be ye valiant:
for your master saul is dead, and also the hous of judah have
anoint me king over them.

2:8 but abner the son of ner, captain of saul' host, took ishbosheth
th son of saul, and brought him over to mahanaim; 2:9 and made him
k over gilead, and over the ashurites, and over jezreel, and over
ephraim, and over benjamin, and over all israel.

2:10 ishbosheth saul' son wa forti year old when he began to reign
ov israel, and reign two years. but the hous of judah followed
david.

2:11 and the time that david wa king in hebron over the hous of
judah wa seven year and six months.

2:12 and abner the son of ner, and the servant of ishbosheth the son
of saul, went out from mahanaim to gibeon.

2:13 and joab the son of zeruiah, and the servant of david, went out,
and met togeth by the pool of gibeon: and they sat down, the one on
th one side of the pool, and the other on the other side of the pool.

2:14 and abner said to joab, let the young men now arise, and play
befor us. and joab said, let them arise.

2:15 then there aros and went over by number twelv of benjamin,
which pertain to ishbosheth the son of saul, and twelv of the
serv of david.

2:16 and they caught everi one hi fellow by the head, and thrust his
sword in hi fellow' side; so they fell down together: wherefor that
plac wa call helkathhazzurim, which is in gibeon.

2:17 and there wa a veri sore battl that day; and abner wa beaten,
and the men of israel, befor the servant of david.

2:18 and there were three son of zeruiah there, joab, and abishai,
and asahel: and asahel wa as light of foot as a wild roe.

2:19 and asahel pursu after abner; and in go he turn not to the
right hand nor to the left from follow abner.

2:20 then abner look behind him, and said, art thou asahel? and he
answered, I am.

2:21 and abner said to him, turn thee asid to thi right hand or to
thi left, and lay thee hold on one of the young men, and take thee his
armour.

but asahel would not turn asid from follow of him.

2:22 and abner said again to asahel, turn thee asid from following
me: wherefor should I smite thee to the ground? how then should i
hold up my face to joab thi brother?  2:23 howbeit he refus to turn
aside: wherefor abner with the hinder end of the spear smote him
und the fifth rib, that the spear came out behind him; and he fell
down there, and die in the same place: and it came to pass, that as
mani as came to the place where asahel fell down and die stood still.

2:24 joab also and abishai pursu after abner: and the sun went down
when they were come to the hill of ammah, that lieth befor giah by
th way of the wilder of gibeon.

2:25 and the children of benjamin gather themselv togeth after
abner, and becam one troop, and stood on the top of an hill.

2:26 then abner call to joab, and said, shall the sword devour for
ever?  knowest thou not that it will be bitter in the latter end?
how long shall it be then, ere thou bid the peopl return from
follow their brethren?  2:27 and joab said, As god liveth, unless
th hadst spoken, sure then in the morn the peopl had gone up
everi one from follow hi brother.

2:28 So joab blew a trumpet, and all the peopl stood still, and
pursu after israel no more, neither fought they ani more.

2:29 and abner and hi men walk all that night through the plain,
and pass over jordan, and went through all bithron, and they came to
mahanaim.

2:30 and joab return from follow abner: and when he had gathered
al the peopl together, there lack of david' servant nineteen men
and asahel.

2:31 but the servant of david had smitten of benjamin, and of abner's
men, so that three hundr and threescor men died.

2:32 and they took up asahel, and buri him in the sepulchr of his
father, which wa in bethlehem. and joab and hi men went all night,
and they came to hebron at break of day.

3:1 now there wa long war between the hous of saul and the hous of
david: but david wax stronger and stronger, and the hous of saul
wax weaker and weaker.

3:2 and unto david were son born in hebron: and hi firstborn was
amnon, of ahinoam the jezreelitess; 3:3 and hi second, chileab, of
abigail the wife of nabal the carmelite; and the third, absalom the
son of maacah the daughter of talmai king of geshur; 3:4 and the
fourth, adonijah the son of haggith; and the fifth, shephatiah the son
of abital; 3:5 and the sixth, ithream, by eglah david' wife. these
wer born to david in hebron.

3:6 and it came to pass, while there wa war between the hous of saul
and the hous of david, that abner made himself strong for the house
of saul.

3:7 and saul had a concubine, whose name wa rizpah, the daughter of
aiah: and ishbosheth said to abner, wherefor hast thou gone in unto
mi father' concubine?  3:8 then wa abner veri wroth for the word of
ishbosheth, and said, Am I a dog' head, which against judah do shew
kind thi day unto the hous of saul thi father, to hi brethren,
and to hi friends, and have not deliv thee into the hand of
david, that thou chargest me to day with a fault concern this
woman?  3:9 So do god to abner, and more also, except, as the lord
hath sworn to david, even so I do to him; 3:10 To translat the
kingdom from the hous of saul, and to set up the throne of david over
israel and over judah, from dan even to beersheba.

3:11 and he could not answer abner a word again, becaus he feared
him.

3:12 and abner sent messeng to david on hi behalf, saying, whose
i the land? say also, make thi leagu with me, and, behold, my
hand shall be with thee, to bring about all israel unto thee.

3:13 and he said, well; I will make a leagu with thee: but one thing
i requir of thee, that is, thou shalt not see my face, except thou
first bring michal saul' daughter, when thou comest to see my face.

3:14 and david sent messeng to ishbosheth saul' son, saying,
deliv me my wife michal, which I espous to me for an hundred
foreskin of the philistines.

3:15 and ishbosheth sent, and took her from her husband, even from
phaltiel the son of laish.

3:16 and her husband went with her along weep behind her to
bahurim.

then said abner unto him, go, return. and he returned.

3:17 and abner had commun with the elder of israel, saying, ye
sought for david in time past to be king over you: 3:18 now then do
it: for the lord hath spoken of david, saying, By the hand of my
serv david I will save my peopl israel out of the hand of the
philistines, and out of the hand of all their enemies.

3:19 and abner also spake in the ear of benjamin: and abner went also
to speak in the ear of david in hebron all that seem good to
israel, and that seem good to the whole hous of benjamin.

3:20 So abner came to david to hebron, and twenti men with him. and
david made abner and the men that were with him a feast.

3:21 and abner said unto david, I will aris and go, and will gather
al israel unto my lord the king, that they may make a leagu with
thee, and that thou mayest reign over all that thine heart desireth.
and david sent abner away; and he went in peace.

3:22 and, behold, the servant of david and joab came from pursu a
troop, and brought in a great spoil with them: but abner wa not with
david in hebron; for he had sent him away, and he wa gone in peace.

3:23 when joab and all the host that wa with him were come, they told
joab, saying, abner the son of ner came to the king, and he hath sent
him away, and he is gone in peace.

3:24 then joab came to the king, and said, what hast thou done?
behold, abner came unto thee; whi is it that thou hast sent him away,
and he is quit gone?  3:25 thou knowest abner the son of ner, that he
cam to deceiv thee, and to know thi go out and thi come in, and
to know all that thou doest.

3:26 and when joab wa come out from david, he sent messeng after
abner, which brought him again from the well of sirah: but david knew
it not.

3:27 and when abner wa return to hebron, joab took him asid in the
gat to speak with him quietly, and smote him there under the fifth
rib, that he died, for the blood of asahel hi brother.

3:28 and afterward when david heard it, he said, I and my kingdom are
guiltless befor the lord for ever from the blood of abner the son of
ner: 3:29 let it rest on the head of joab, and on all hi father's
house; and let there not fail from the hous of joab one that hath an
issue, or that is a leper, or that leaneth on a staff, or that falleth
on the sword, or that lacketh bread.

3:30 So joab, and abishai hi brother slew abner, becaus he had slain
their brother asahel at gibeon in the battle.

3:31 and david said to joab, and to all the peopl that were with him,
rend your clothes, and gird you with sackcloth, and mourn before
abner. and king david himself follow the bier.

3:32 and they buri abner in hebron: and the king lift up his
voice, and wept at the grave of abner; and all the peopl wept.

3:33 and the king lament over abner, and said, die abner as a fool
dieth?  3:34 thi hand were not bound, nor thi feet put into fetters:
a a man falleth befor wick men, so fellest thou. and all the
peopl wept again over him.

3:35 and when all the peopl came to caus david to eat meat while it
wa yet day, david sware, saying, So do god to me, and more also, if i
tast bread, or ought else, till the sun be down.

3:36 and all the peopl took notic of it, and it pleas them: as
whatsoev the king did pleas all the people.

3:37 for all the peopl and all israel understood that day that it was
not of the king to slay abner the son of ner.

3:38 and the king said unto hi servants, know ye not that there is a
princ and a great man fallen thi day in israel?  3:39 and I am this
day weak, though anoint king; and these men the son of zeruiah be
too hard for me: the lord shall reward the doer of evil accord to
hi wickedness.

4:1 and when saul' son heard that abner wa dead in hebron, hi hands
wer feeble, and all the israelit were troubled.

4:2 and saul' son had two men that were captain of bands: the name
of the one wa baanah, and the name of the other rechab, the son of
rimmon a beerothite, of the children of benjamin: (for beeroth also
wa reckon to benjamin.

4:3 and the beerothit fled to gittaim, and were sojourn there
until thi day.)  4:4 and jonathan, saul' son, had a son that was
lam of hi feet. He wa five year old when the tide came of saul
and jonathan out of jezreel, and hi nurs took him up, and fled: and
it came to pass, as she made hast to flee, that he fell, and became
lame. and hi name wa mephibosheth.

4:5 and the son of rimmon the beerothite, rechab and baanah, went,
and came about the heat of the day to the hous of ishbosheth, who lay
on a bed at noon.

4:6 and they came thither into the midst of the house, as though they
would have fetch wheat; and they smote him under the fifth rib: and
rechab and baanah hi brother escaped.

4:7 for when they came into the house, he lay on hi bed in his
bedchamber, and they smote him, and slew him, and behead him, and
took hi head, and gat them away through the plain all night.

4:8 and they brought the head of ishbosheth unto david to hebron, and
said to the king, behold the head of ishbosheth the son of saul thine
enemy, which sought thi life; and the lord hath aveng my lord the
k thi day of saul, and of hi seed.

4:9 and david answer rechab and baanah hi brother, the son of
rimmon the beerothite, and said unto them, As the lord liveth, who
hath redeem my soul out of all adversity, 4:10 when one told me,
saying, behold, saul is dead, think to have brought good tidings, i
took hold of him, and slew him in ziklag, who thought that I would
hav given him a reward for hi tidings: 4:11 how much more, when
wick men have slain a righteou person in hi own hous upon his
bed? shall I not therefor now requir hi blood of your hand, and
tak you away from the earth?  4:12 and david command hi young men,
and they slew them, and cut off their hand and their feet, and hanged
them up over the pool in hebron. but they took the head of ishbosheth,
and buri it in the sepulchr of abner in hebron.

5:1 then came all the tribe of israel to david unto hebron, and
spake, saying, behold, we are thi bone and thi flesh.

5:2 also in time past, when saul wa king over us, thou wast he that
leddest out and broughtest in israel: and the lord said to thee, thou
shalt feed my peopl israel, and thou shalt be a captain over israel.

5:3 So all the elder of israel came to the king to hebron; and king
david made a leagu with them in hebron befor the lord: and they
anoint david king over israel.

5:4 david wa thirti year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
forti years.

5:5 In hebron he reign over judah seven year and six months: and in
jerusalem he reign thirti and three year over all israel and judah.

5:6 and the king and hi men went to jerusalem unto the jebusites, the
inhabit of the land: which spake unto david, saying, except thou
tak away the blind and the lame, thou shalt not come in hither:
thinking, david cannot come in hither.

5:7 nevertheless david took the strong hold of zion: the same is the
citi of david.

5:8 and david said on that day, whosoev getteth up to the gutter,
and smiteth the jebusites, and the lame and the blind that are hated
of david' soul, he shall be chief and captain. wherefor they said,
th blind and the lame shall not come into the house.

5:9 So david dwelt in the fort, and call it the citi of david. and
david built round about from millo and inward.

5:10 and david went on, and grew great, and the lord god of host was
with him.

5:11 and hiram king of tyre sent messeng to david, and cedar trees,
and carpenters, and masons: and they built david an house.

5:12 and david perceiv that the lord had establish him king over
israel, and that he had exalt hi kingdom for hi peopl israel's
sake.

5:13 and david took him more concubin and wive out of jerusalem,
aft he wa come from hebron: and there were yet son and daughters
born to david.

5:14 and these be the name of those that were born unto him in
jerusalem; shammuah, and shobab, and nathan, and solomon, 5:15 ibhar
also, and elishua, and nepheg, and japhia, 5:16 and elishama, and
eliada, and eliphalet.

5:17 but when the philistin heard that they had anoint david king
ov israel, all the philistin came up to seek david; and david
heard of it, and went down to the hold.

5:18 the philistin also came and spread themselv in the valley of
rephaim.

5:19 and david enquir of the lord, saying, shall I go up to the
philistines? wilt thou deliv them into mine hand? and the lord said
unto david, Go up: for I will doubtless deliv the philistin into
thin hand.

5:20 and david came to baalperazim, and david smote them there, and
said, the lord hath broken forth upon mine enemi befor me, as the
breach of waters. therefor he call the name of that place
baalperazim.

5:21 and there they left their images, and david and hi men burned
them.

5:22 and the philistin came up yet again, and spread themselv in
th valley of rephaim.

5:23 and when david enquir of the lord, he said, thou shalt not go
up; but fetch a compass behind them, and come upon them over against
th mulberri trees.

5:24 and let it be, when thou hearest the sound of a go in the tops
of the mulberri trees, that then thou shalt bestir thyself: for then
shal the lord go out befor thee, to smite the host of the
philistines.

5:25 and david did so, as the lord had command him; and smote the
philistin from geba until thou come to gazer.

6:1 again, david gather togeth all the chosen men of israel,
thirti thousand.

6:2 and david arose, and went with all the peopl that were with him
from baal of judah, to bring up from thenc the ark of god, whose
nam is call by the name of the lord of host that dwelleth between
th cherubims.

6:3 and they set the ark of god upon a new cart, and brought it out of
th hous of abinadab that wa in gibeah: and uzzah and ahio, the sons
of abinadab, drave the new cart.

6:4 and they brought it out of the hous of abinadab which wa at
gibeah, accompani the ark of god: and ahio went befor the ark.

6:5 and david and all the hous of israel play befor the lord on
al manner of instrument made of fir wood, even on harps, and on
psalteries, and on timbrels, and on cornets, and on cymbals.

6:6 and when they came to nachon' threshingfloor, uzzah put forth his
hand to the ark of god, and took hold of it; for the oxen shook it.

6:7 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against uzzah; and god smote
him there for hi error; and there he die by the ark of god.

6:8 and david wa displeased, becaus the lord had made a breach upon
uzzah: and he call the name of the place perezuzzah to thi day.

6:9 and david wa afraid of the lord that day, and said, how shall the
ark of the lord come to me?  6:10 So david would not remov the ark of
th lord unto him into the citi of david: but david carri it aside
into the hous of obededom the gittite.

6:11 and the ark of the lord continu in the hous of obededom the
gittit three months: and the lord bless obededom, and all his
household.

6:12 and it wa told king david, saying, the lord hath bless the
hous of obededom, and all that pertaineth unto him, becaus of the
ark of god. So david went and brought up the ark of god from the house
of obededom into the citi of david with gladness.

6:13 and it wa so, that when they that bare the ark of the lord had
gon six paces, he sacrif oxen and fatlings.

6:14 and david danc befor the lord with all hi might; and david
wa gird with a linen ephod.

6:15 So david and all the hous of israel brought up the ark of the
lord with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet.

6:16 and as the ark of the lord came into the citi of david, michal
saul' daughter look through a window, and saw king david leaping
and danc befor the lord; and she despis him in her heart.

6:17 and they brought in the ark of the lord, and set it in hi place,
in the midst of the tabernacl that david had pitch for it: and
david offer burnt offer and peac offer befor the lord.

6:18 and as soon as david had made an end of offer burnt offerings
and peac offerings, he bless the peopl in the name of the lord of
hosts.

6:19 and he dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude
of israel, as well to the women as men, to everi one a cake of bread,
and a good piec of flesh, and a flagon of wine. So all the people
depart everi one to hi house.

6:20 then david return to bless hi household. and michal the
daught of saul came out to meet david, and said, how gloriou was
th king of israel to day, who uncov himself to day in the eye of
th handmaid of hi servants, as one of the vain fellow shamelessly
uncovereth himself!  6:21 and david said unto michal, It wa before
th lord, which chose me befor thi father, and befor all hi house,
to appoint me ruler over the peopl of the lord, over israel:
therefor will I play befor the lord.

6:22 and I will yet be more vile than thus, and will be base in mine
own sight: and of the maidserv which thou hast spoken of, of them
shal I be had in honour.

6:23 therefor michal the daughter of saul had no child unto the day
of her death.

7:1 and it came to pass, when the king sat in hi house, and the lord
had given him rest round about from all hi enemies; 7:2 that the king
said unto nathan the prophet, see now, I dwell in an hous of cedar,
but the ark of god dwelleth within curtains.

7:3 and nathan said to the king, go, do all that is in thine heart;
for the lord is with thee.

7:4 and it came to pass that night, that the word of the lord came
unto nathan, saying, 7:5 Go and tell my servant david, thu saith the
lord, shalt thou build me an hous for me to dwell in?  7:6 wherea i
hav not dwelt in ani hous sinc the time that I brought up the
children of israel out of egypt, even to thi day, but have walk in
a tent and in a tabernacle.

7:7 In all the place wherein I have walk with all the children of
israel spake I a word with ani of the tribe of israel, whom i
command to feed my peopl israel, saying, whi build ye not me an
hous of cedar?  7:8 now therefor so shalt thou say unto my servant
david, thu saith the lord of hosts, I took thee from the sheepcote,
from follow the sheep, to be ruler over my people, over israel: 7:9
and I wa with thee whithersoev thou wentest, and have cut off all
thin enemi out of thi sight, and have made thee a great name, like
unto the name of the great men that are in the earth.

7:10 moreov I will appoint a place for my peopl israel, and will
plant them, that they may dwell in a place of their own, and move no
more; neither shall the children of wicked afflict them ani more,
a beforetime, 7:11 and as sinc the time that I command judg to
b over my peopl israel, and have caus thee to rest from all thine
enemies. also the lord telleth thee that he will make thee an house.

7:12 and when thi day be fulfilled, and thou shalt sleep with thy
fathers, I will set up thi seed after thee, which shall proceed out of
thi bowels, and I will establish hi kingdom.

7:13 He shall build an hous for my name, and I will stablish the
thron of hi kingdom for ever.

7:14 I will be hi father, and he shall be my son. If he commit
iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes
of the children of men: 7:15 but my merci shall not depart away from
him, as I took it from saul, whom I put away befor thee.

7:16 and thine hous and thi kingdom shall be establish for ever
befor thee: thi throne shall be establish for ever.

7:17 accord to all these words, and accord to all thi vision,
so did nathan speak unto david.

7:18 then went king david in, and sat befor the lord, and he said,
who am I, O lord god? and what is my house, that thou hast brought me
hitherto?  7:19 and thi wa yet a small thing in thi sight, O lord
god; but thou hast spoken also of thi servant' hous for a great
whil to come. and is thi the manner of man, O lord god?  7:20 and
what can david say more unto thee? for thou, lord god, knowest thy
servant.

7:21 for thi word' sake, and accord to thine own heart, hast thou
don all these great things, to make thi servant know them.

7:22 wherefor thou art great, O lord god: for there is none like
thee, neither is there ani god besid thee, accord to all that we
hav heard with our ears.

7:23 and what one nation in the earth is like thi people, even like
israel, whom god went to redeem for a peopl to himself, and to make
him a name, and to do for you great thing and terrible, for thi land,
befor thi people, which thou redeemedst to thee from egypt, from the
nat and their gods?  7:24 for thou hast confirm to thyself thy
peopl israel to be a peopl unto thee for ever: and thou, lord, art
becom their god.

7:25 and now, O lord god, the word that thou hast spoken concerning
thi servant, and concern hi house, establish it for ever, and do
a thou hast said.

7:26 and let thi name be magnifi for ever, saying, the lord of hosts
i the god over israel: and let the hous of thi servant david be
establish befor thee.

7:27 for thou, O lord of hosts, god of israel, hast reveal to thy
servant, saying, I will build thee an house: therefor hath thy
serv found in hi heart to pray thi prayer unto thee.

7:28 and now, O lord god, thou art that god, and thi word be true,
and thou hast promis thi good unto thi servant: 7:29 therefore
now let it pleas thee to bless the hous of thi servant, that it may
continu for ever befor thee: for thou, O lord god, hast spoken it:
and with thi bless let the hous of thi servant be bless for
ever.

8:1 and after thi it came to pass that david smote the philistines,
and subdu them: and david took methegammah out of the hand of the
philistines.

8:2 and he smote moab, and measur them with a line, cast them
down to the ground; even with two line measur he to put to death,
and with one full line to keep alive. and so the moabit became
david' servants, and brought gifts.

8:3 david smote also hadadezer, the son of rehob, king of zobah, as he
went to recov hi border at the river euphrates.

8:4 and david took from him a thousand chariots, and seven hundred
horsemen, and twenti thousand footmen: and david hough all the
chariot horses, but reserv of them for an hundr chariots.

8:5 and when the syrian of damascu came to succour hadadez king of
zobah, david slew of the syrian two and twenti thousand men.

8:6 then david put garrison in syria of damascus: and the syrians
becam servant to david, and brought gifts. and the lord preserved
david whithersoev he went.

8:7 and david took the shield of gold that were on the servant of
hadadezer, and brought them to jerusalem.

8:8 and from betah, and from berothai, citi of hadadezer, king david
took exceed much brass.

8:9 when toi king of hamath heard that david had smitten all the host
of hadadezer, 8:10 then toi sent joram hi son unto king david, to
salut him, and to bless him, becaus he had fought against hadadezer,
and smitten him: for hadadez had war with toi. and joram brought
with him vessel of silver, and vessel of gold, and vessel of brass:
8:11 which also king david did dedic unto the lord, with the silver
and gold that he had dedic of all nation which he subdued; 8:12
of syria, and of moab, and of the children of ammon, and of the
philistines, and of amalek, and of the spoil of hadadezer, son of
rehob, king of zobah.

8:13 and david gat him a name when he return from smite of the
syrian in the valley of salt, be eighteen thousand men.

8:14 and he put garrison in edom; throughout all edom put he
garrisons, and all they of edom becam david' servants. and the lord
preserv david whithersoev he went.

8:15 and david reign over all israel; and david execut judgment
and justic unto all hi people.

8:16 and joab the son of zeruiah wa over the host; and jehoshaphat
