th son of ahilud wa recorder; 8:17 and zadok the son of ahitub, and
ahimelech the son of abiathar, were the priests; and seraiah wa the
scribe; 8:18 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over both the
cherethit and the pelethites; and david' son were chief rulers.

9:1 and david said, Is there yet ani that is left of the hous of
saul, that I may shew him kind for jonathan' sake?  9:2 and there
wa of the hous of saul a servant whose name wa ziba. and when they
had call him unto david, the king said unto him, art thou ziba?  and
h said, thi servant is he.

9:3 and the king said, Is there not yet ani of the hous of saul, that
i may shew the kind of god unto him? and ziba said unto the king,
jonathan hath yet a son, which is lame on hi feet.

9:4 and the king said unto him, where is he? and ziba said unto the
king, behold, he is in the hous of machir, the son of ammiel, in
lodebar.

9:5 then king david sent, and fetch him out of the hous of machir,
th son of ammiel, from lodebar.

9:6 now when mephibosheth, the son of jonathan, the son of saul, was
com unto david, he fell on hi face, and did reverence. and david
said, mephibosheth. and he answered, behold thi servant!  9:7 and
david said unto him, fear not: for I will sure shew thee kindness
for jonathan thi father' sake, and will restor thee all the land of
saul thi father; and thou shalt eat bread at my tabl continually.

9:8 and he bow himself, and said, what is thi servant, that thou
shouldest look upon such a dead dog as I am?  9:9 then the king called
to ziba, saul' servant, and said unto him, I have given unto thy
master' son all that pertain to saul and to all hi house.

9:10 thou therefore, and thi sons, and thi servants, shall till the
land for him, and thou shalt bring in the fruits, that thi master's
son may have food to eat: but mephibosheth thi master' son shall eat
bread alway at my table. now ziba had fifteen son and twenty
servants.

9:11 then said ziba unto the king, accord to all that my lord the
k hath command hi servant, so shall thi servant do. As for
mephibosheth, said the king, he shall eat at my table, as one of the
king' sons.

9:12 and mephibosheth had a young son, whose name wa micha. and all
that dwelt in the hous of ziba were servant unto mephibosheth.

9:13 So mephibosheth dwelt in jerusalem: for he did eat continu at
th king' table; and wa lame on both hi feet.

10:1 and it came to pass after this, that the king of the children of
ammon died, and hanun hi son reign in hi stead.

10:2 then said david, I will shew kind unto hanun the son of
nahash, as hi father shew kind unto me. and david sent to
comfort him by the hand of hi servant for hi father. and david's
serv came into the land of the children of ammon.

10:3 and the princ of the children of ammon said unto hanun their
lord, thinkest thou that david doth honour thi father, that he hath
sent comfort unto thee? hath not david rather sent hi servants
unto thee, to search the city, and to spi it out, and to overthrow it?
10:4 wherefor hanun took david' servants, and shave off the one
half of their beards, and cut off their garment in the middle, even
to their buttocks, and sent them away.

10:5 when they told it unto david, he sent to meet them, becaus the
men were greatli ashamed: and the king said, tarri at jericho until
your beard be grown, and then return.

10:6 and when the children of ammon saw that they stank befor david,
th children of ammon sent and hire the syrian of bethrehob and the
syrian of zoba, twenti thousand footmen, and of king maacah a
thousand men, and of ishtob twelv thousand men.

10:7 and when david heard of it, he sent joab, and all the host of the
mighti men.

10:8 and the children of ammon came out, and put the battl in array
at the enter in of the gate: and the syrian of zoba, and of rehob,
and ishtob, and maacah, were by themselv in the field.

10:9 when joab saw that the front of the battl wa against him before
and behind, he chose of all the choic men of israel, and put them in
array against the syrians: 10:10 and the rest of the peopl he
deliv into the hand of abishai hi brother, that he might put them
in array against the children of ammon.

10:11 and he said, If the syrian be too strong for me, then thou
shalt help me: but if the children of ammon be too strong for thee,
then I will come and help thee.

10:12 Be of good courage, and let us play the men for our people, and
for the citi of our god: and the lord do that which seemeth him
good.

10:13 and joab drew nigh, and the peopl that were with him, unto the
battl against the syrians: and they fled befor him.

10:14 and when the children of ammon saw that the syrian were fled,
then fled they also befor abishai, and enter into the city. So joab
return from the children of ammon, and came to jerusalem.

10:15 and when the syrian saw that they were smitten befor israel,
they gather themselv together.

10:16 and hadarez sent, and brought out the syrian that were beyond
th river: and they came to helam; and shobach the captain of the host
of hadarez went befor them.

10:17 and when it wa told david, he gather all israel together, and
pass over jordan, and came to helam. and the syrian set themselves
in array against david, and fought with him.

10:18 and the syrian fled befor israel; and david slew the men of
seven hundr chariot of the syrians, and forti thousand horsemen,
and smote shobach the captain of their host, who die there.

10:19 and when all the king that were servant to hadarez saw that
they were smitten befor israel, they made peac with israel, and
serv them. So the syrian fear to help the children of ammon any
more.

11:1 and it came to pass, after the year wa expired, at the time when
k go forth to battle, that david sent joab, and hi servant with
him, and all israel; and they destroy the children of ammon, and
besieg rabbah. but david tarri still at jerusalem.

11:2 and it came to pass in an eveningtide, that david aros from off
hi bed, and walk upon the roof of the king' house: and from the
roof he saw a woman wash herself; and the woman wa veri beautiful
to look upon.

11:3 and david sent and enquir after the woman. and one said, Is not
thi bathsheba, the daughter of eliam, the wife of uriah the hittite?
11:4 and david sent messengers, and took her; and she came in unto
him, and he lay with her; for she wa purifi from her uncleanness:
and she return unto her house.

11:5 and the woman conceived, and sent and told david, and said, I am
with child.

11:6 and david sent to joab, saying, send me uriah the hittite. and
joab sent uriah to david.

11:7 and when uriah wa come unto him, david demand of him how joab
did, and how the peopl did, and how the war prospered.

11:8 and david said to uriah, Go down to thi house, and wash thi feet.
and uriah depart out of the king' house, and there follow him a
mess of meat from the king.

11:9 but uriah slept at the door of the king' hous with all the
serv of hi lord, and went not down to hi house.

11:10 and when they had told david, saying, uriah went not down unto
hi house, david said unto uriah, camest thou not from thi journey?
whi then didst thou not go down unto thine house?  11:11 and uriah
said unto david, the ark, and israel, and judah, abid in tents; and
mi lord joab, and the servant of my lord, are encamp in the open
fields; shall I then go into mine house, to eat and to drink, and to
li with my wife? as thou livest, and as thi soul liveth, I will not
do thi thing.

11:12 and david said to uriah, tarri here to day also, and to morrow i
wil let thee depart. So uriah abod in jerusalem that day, and the
morrow.

11:13 and when david had call him, he did eat and drink befor him;
and he made him drunk: and at even he went out to lie on hi bed with
th servant of hi lord, but went not down to hi house.

11:14 and it came to pass in the morning, that david wrote a letter to
joab, and sent it by the hand of uriah.

11:15 and he wrote in the letter, saying, set ye uriah in the
forefront of the hottest battle, and retir ye from him, that he may
b smitten, and die.

11:16 and it came to pass, when joab observ the city, that he
assign uriah unto a place where he knew that valiant men were.

11:17 and the men of the citi went out, and fought with joab: and
ther fell some of the peopl of the servant of david; and uriah the
hittit die also.

11:18 then joab sent and told david all the thing concern the war;
11:19 and charg the messenger, saying, when thou hast made an end of
tel the matter of the war unto the king, 11:20 and if so be that
th king' wrath arise, and he say unto thee, wherefor approach ye
so nigh unto the citi when ye did fight? knew ye not that they would
shoot from the wall?  11:21 who smote abimelech the son of
jerubbesheth? did not a woman cast a piec of a millston upon him
from the wall, that he die in thebez? whi went ye nigh the wall? then
say thou, thi servant uriah the hittit is dead also.

11:22 So the messeng went, and came and shew david all that joab
had sent him for.

11:23 and the messeng said unto david, sure the men prevailed
against us, and came out unto us into the field, and we were upon them
even unto the enter of the gate.

11:24 and the shooter shot from off the wall upon thi servants; and
som of the king' servant be dead, and thi servant uriah the hittite
i dead also.

11:25 then david said unto the messenger, thu shalt thou say unto
joab, let not thi thing displeas thee, for the sword devoureth one
a well as another: make thi battl more strong against the city, and
overthrow it: and encourag thou him.

11:26 and when the wife of uriah heard that uriah her husband was
dead, she mourn for her husband.

11:27 and when the mourn wa past, david sent and fetch her to
hi house, and she becam hi wife, and bare him a son. but the thing
that david had done displeas the lord.

12:1 and the lord sent nathan unto david. and he came unto him, and
said unto him, there were two men in one city; the one rich, and the
oth poor.

12:2 the rich man had exceed mani flock and herds: 12:3 but the
poor man had nothing, save one littl ewe lamb, which he had bought
and nourish up: and it grew up togeth with him, and with his
children; it did eat of hi own meat, and drank of hi own cup, and
lay in hi bosom, and wa unto him as a daughter.

12:4 and there came a travel unto the rich man, and he spare to
tak of hi own flock and of hi own herd, to dress for the wayfaring
man that wa come unto him; but took the poor man' lamb, and dressed
it for the man that wa come to him.

12:5 and david' anger wa greatli kindl against the man; and he
said to nathan, As the lord liveth, the man that hath done thi thing
shal sure die: 12:6 and he shall restor the lamb fourfold, because
h did thi thing, and becaus he had no pity.

12:7 and nathan said to david, thou art the man. thu saith the lord
god of israel, I anoint thee king over israel, and I deliv thee
out of the hand of saul; 12:8 and I gave thee thi master' house, and
thi master' wive into thi bosom, and gave thee the hous of israel
and of judah; and if that had been too little, I would moreov have
given unto thee such and such things.

12:9 wherefor hast thou despis the command of the lord, to do
evil in hi sight? thou hast kill uriah the hittit with the sword,
and hast taken hi wife to be thi wife, and hast slain him with the
sword of the children of ammon.

12:10 now therefor the sword shall never depart from thine house;
becaus thou hast despis me, and hast taken the wife of uriah the
hittit to be thi wife.

12:11 thu saith the lord, behold, I will rais up evil against thee
out of thine own house, and I will take thi wive befor thine eyes,
and give them unto thi neighbour, and he shall lie with thi wive in
th sight of thi sun.

12:12 for thou didst it secretly: but I will do thi thing befor all
israel, and befor the sun.

12:13 and david said unto nathan, I have sin against the lord. and
nathan said unto david, the lord also hath put away thi sin; thou
shalt not die.

12:14 howbeit, becaus by thi deed thou hast given great occas to
th enemi of the lord to blaspheme, the child also that is born unto
the shall sure die.

12:15 and nathan depart unto hi house. and the lord struck the
child that uriah' wife bare unto david, and it wa veri sick.

12:16 david therefor besought god for the child; and david fasted,
and went in, and lay all night upon the earth.

12:17 and the elder of hi hous arose, and went to him, to rais him
up from the earth: but he would not, neither did he eat bread with
them.

12:18 and it came to pass on the seventh day, that the child died. and
th servant of david fear to tell him that the child wa dead: for
they said, behold, while the child wa yet alive, we spake unto him,
and he would not hearken unto our voice: how will he then vex himself,
if we tell him that the child is dead?  12:19 but when david saw that
hi servant whispered, david perceiv that the child wa dead:
therefor david said unto hi servants, Is the child dead? and they
said, He is dead.

12:20 then david aros from the earth, and washed, and anointed
himself, and chang hi apparel, and came into the hous of the lord,
and worshipped: then he came to hi own house; and when he required,
they set bread befor him, and he did eat.

12:21 then said hi servant unto him, what thing is thi that thou
hast done? thou didst fast and weep for the child, while it wa alive;
but when the child wa dead, thou didst rise and eat bread.

12:22 and he said, while the child wa yet alive, I fast and wept:
for I said, who can tell whether god will be graciou to me, that the
child may live?  12:23 but now he is dead, wherefor should I fast?
can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he shall not return
to me.

12:24 and david comfort bathsheba hi wife, and went in unto her,
and lay with her: and she bare a son, and he call hi name solomon:
and the lord love him.

12:25 and he sent by the hand of nathan the prophet; and he call his
nam jedidiah, becaus of the lord.

12:26 and joab fought against rabbah of the children of ammon, and
took the royal city.

12:27 and joab sent messeng to david, and said, I have fought
against rabbah, and have taken the citi of waters.

12:28 now therefor gather the rest of the peopl together, and encamp
against the city, and take it: lest I take the city, and it be called
aft my name.

12:29 and david gather all the peopl together, and went to rabbah,
and fought against it, and took it.

12:30 and he took their king' crown from off hi head, the weight
whereof wa a talent of gold with the preciou stones: and it wa set
on david' head. and he brought forth the spoil of the citi in great
abundance.

12:31 and he brought forth the peopl that were therein, and put them
und saws, and under harrow of iron, and under axe of iron, and
mad them pass through the brick-kiln: and thu did he unto all the
citi of the children of ammon. So david and all the peopl returned
unto jerusalem.

13:1 and it came to pass after this, that absalom the son of david had
a fair sister, whose name wa tamar; and amnon the son of david loved
her.

13:2 and amnon wa so vexed, that he fell sick for hi sister tamar;
for she wa a virgin; and amnon thought it hard for him to do anything
to her.

13:3 but amnon had a friend, whose name wa jonadab, the son of
shimeah david' brother: and jonadab wa a veri subtil man.

13:4 and he said unto him, whi art thou, be the king' son, lean
from day to day? wilt thou not tell me? and amnon said unto him, i
lov tamar, my brother absalom' sister.

13:5 and jonadab said unto him, lay thee down on thi bed, and make
thyself sick: and when thi father cometh to see thee, say unto him, i
pray thee, let my sister tamar come, and give me meat, and dress the
meat in my sight, that I may see it, and eat it at her hand.

13:6 So amnon lay down, and made himself sick: and when the king was
com to see him, amnon said unto the king, I pray thee, let tamar my
sist come, and make me a coupl of cake in my sight, that I may eat
at her hand.

13:7 then david sent home to tamar, saying, Go now to thi brother
amnon' house, and dress him meat.

13:8 So tamar went to her brother amnon' house; and he wa laid down.
and she took flour, and knead it, and made cake in hi sight, and
did bake the cakes.

13:9 and she took a pan, and pour them out befor him; but he
refus to eat. and amnon said, have out all men from me. and they
went out everi man from him.

13:10 and amnon said unto tamar, bring the meat into the chamber, that
i may eat of thine hand. and tamar took the cake which she had made,
and brought them into the chamber to amnon her brother.

13:11 and when she had brought them unto him to eat, he took hold of
her, and said unto her, come lie with me, my sister.

13:12 and she answer him, nay, my brother, do not forc me; for no
such thing ought to be done in israel: do not thou thi folly.

13:13 and I, whither shall I caus my shame to go? and as for thee,
thou shalt be as one of the fool in israel. now therefore, I pray
thee, speak unto the king; for he will not withhold me from thee.

13:14 howbeit he would not hearken unto her voice: but, be stronger
than she, forc her, and lay with her.

13:15 then amnon hate her exceedingly; so that the hatr wherewith
h hate her wa greater than the love wherewith he had love her. and
amnon said unto her, arise, be gone.

13:16 and she said unto him, there is no cause: thi evil in sending
m away is greater than the other that thou didst unto me. but he
would not hearken unto her.

13:17 then he call hi servant that minist unto him, and said,
put now thi woman out from me, and bolt the door after her.

13:18 and she had a garment of diver colour upon her: for with such
rob were the king' daughter that were virgin apparelled. then his
serv brought her out, and bolt the door after her.

13:19 and tamar put ash on her head, and rent her garment of divers
colour that wa on her, and laid her hand on her head, and went on
crying.

13:20 and absalom her brother said unto her, hath amnon thi brother
been with thee? but hold now thi peace, my sister: he is thi brother;
regard not thi thing. So tamar remain desol in her brother
absalom' house.

13:21 but when king david heard of all these things, he wa very
wroth.

13:22 and absalom spake unto hi brother amnon neither good nor bad:
for absalom hate amnon, becaus he had forc hi sister tamar.

13:23 and it came to pass after two full years, that absalom had
sheepshear in baalhazor, which is besid ephraim: and absalom
invit all the king' sons.

13:24 and absalom came to the king, and said, behold now, thi servant
hath sheepshearers; let the king, I beseech thee, and hi servant go
with thi servant.

13:25 and the king said to absalom, nay, my son, let us not all now
go, lest we be chargeabl unto thee. and he press him: howbeit he
would not go, but bless him.

13:26 then said absalom, If not, I pray thee, let my brother amnon go
with us. and the king said unto him, whi should he go with thee?
13:27 but absalom press him, that he let amnon and all the king's
son go with him.

13:28 now absalom had command hi servants, saying, mark ye now when
amnon' heart is merri with wine, and when I say unto you, smite
amnon; then kill him, fear not: have not I command you? be
courageous, and be valiant.

13:29 and the servant of absalom did unto amnon as absalom had
commanded.

then all the king' son arose, and everi man gat him up upon his
mule, and fled.

13:30 and it came to pass, while they were in the way, that tidings
cam to david, saying, absalom hath slain all the king' sons, and
ther is not one of them left.

13:31 then the king arose, and tare hi garments, and lay on the
earth; and all hi servant stood by with their cloth rent.

13:32 and jonadab, the son of shimeah david' brother, answer and
said, let not my lord suppos that they have slain all the young men
th king' sons; for amnon onli is dead: for by the appoint of
absalom thi hath been determin from the day that he forc his
sist tamar.

13:33 now therefor let not my lord the king take the thing to his
heart, to think that all the king' son are dead: for amnon onli is
dead.

13:34 but absalom fled. and the young man that kept the watch lifted
up hi eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came much peopl by the
way of the hill side behind him.

13:35 and jonadab said unto the king, behold, the king' son come: as
thi servant said, so it is.

13:36 and it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of speaking,
that, behold, the king' son came, and lift up their voic and
wept: and the king also and all hi servant wept veri sore.

13:37 but absalom fled, and went to talmai, the son of ammihud, king
of geshur. and david mourn for hi son everi day.

13:38 So absalom fled, and went to geshur, and wa there three years.

13:39 and the soul of king david long to go forth unto absalom: for
h wa comfort concern amnon, see he wa dead.

14:1 now joab the son of zeruiah perceiv that the king' heart was
toward absalom.

14:2 and joab sent to tekoah, and fetch thenc a wise woman, and
said unto her, I pray thee, feign thyself to be a mourner, and put on
now mourn apparel, and anoint not thyself with oil, but be as a
woman that had a long time mourn for the dead: 14:3 and come to the
king, and speak on thi manner unto him. So joab put the word in her
mouth.

14:4 and when the woman of tekoah spake to the king, she fell on her
fac to the ground, and did obeisance, and said, help, O king.

14:5 and the king said unto her, what aileth thee? and she answered, i
am inde a widow woman, and mine husband is dead.

14:6 and thi handmaid had two sons, and they two strove togeth in
th field, and there wa none to part them, but the one smote the
other, and slew him.

14:7 and, behold, the whole famili is risen against thine handmaid,
and they said, deliv him that smote hi brother, that we may kill
him, for the life of hi brother whom he slew; and we will destroy the
heir also: and so they shall quench my coal which is left, and shall
not leav to my husband neither name nor remaind upon the earth.

14:8 and the king said unto the woman, Go to thine house, and I will
giv charg concern thee.

14:9 and the woman of tekoah said unto the king, My lord, O king, the
iniqu be on me, and on my father' house: and the king and his
thron be guiltless.

14:10 and the king said, whoever saith ought unto thee, bring him to
me, and he shall not touch thee ani more.

14:11 then said she, I pray thee, let the king rememb the lord thy
god, that thou wouldest not suffer the reveng of blood to destroy
ani more, lest they destroy my son. and he said, As the lord liveth,
ther shall not one hair of thi son fall to the earth.

14:12 then the woman said, let thine handmaid, I pray thee, speak one
word unto my lord the king. and he said, say on.

14:13 and the woman said, wherefor then hast thou thought such a
th against the peopl of god? for the king doth speak thi thing as
on which is faulty, in that the king doth not fetch home again his
banished.

14:14 for we must need die, and are as water spilt on the ground,
which cannot be gather up again; neither doth god respect any
person: yet doth he devis means, that hi banish be not expelled
from him.

14:15 now therefor that I am come to speak of thi thing unto my lord
th king, it is becaus the peopl have made me afraid: and thy
handmaid said, I will now speak unto the king; it may be that the king
wil perform the request of hi handmaid.

14:16 for the king will hear, to deliv hi handmaid out of the hand
of the man that would destroy me and my son togeth out of the
inherit of god.

14:17 then thine handmaid said, the word of my lord the king shall now
b comfortable: for as an angel of god, so is my lord the king to
discern good and bad: therefor the lord thi god will be with thee.

14:18 then the king answer and said unto the woman, hide not from
me, I pray thee, the thing that I shall ask thee. and the woman said,
let my lord the king now speak.

14:19 and the king said, Is not the hand of joab with thee in all
this?  and the woman answer and said, As thi soul liveth, my lord
th king, none can turn to the right hand or to the left from ought
that my lord the king hath spoken: for thi servant joab, he bade me,
and he put all these word in the mouth of thine handmaid: 14:20 to
fetch about thi form of speech hath thi servant joab done thi thing:
and my lord is wise, accord to the wisdom of an angel of god, to
know all thing that are in the earth.

14:21 and the king said unto joab, behold now, I have done thi thing:
go therefore, bring the young man absalom again.

14:22 and joab fell to the ground on hi face, and bow himself, and
thank the king: and joab said, To day thi servant knoweth that i
hav found grace in thi sight, my lord, O king, in that the king hath
fulfil the request of hi servant.

14:23 So joab aros and went to geshur, and brought absalom to
jerusalem.

14:24 and the king said, let him turn to hi own house, and let him
not see my face. So absalom return to hi own house, and saw not the
king' face.

14:25 but in all israel there wa none to be so much prais as
absalom for hi beauty: from the sole of hi foot even to the crown of
hi head there wa no blemish in him.

14:26 and when he poll hi head, (for it wa at everi year' end
that he poll it: becaus the hair wa heavi on him, therefor he
pol it:) he weigh the hair of hi head at two hundr shekels
aft the king' weight.

14:27 and unto absalom there were born three sons, and one daughter,
whos name wa tamar: she wa a woman of a fair countenance.

14:28 So absalom dwelt two full year in jerusalem, and saw not the
king' face.

14:29 therefor absalom sent for joab, to have sent him to the king;
but he would not come to him: and when he sent again the second time,
h would not come.

14:30 therefor he said unto hi servants, see, joab' field is near
mine, and he hath barley there; go and set it on fire. and absalom's
serv set the field on fire.

14:31 then joab arose, and came to absalom unto hi house, and said
unto him, wherefor have thi servant set my field on fire?  14:32 and
absalom answer joab, behold, I sent unto thee, saying, come hither,
that I may send thee to the king, to say, wherefor am I come from
geshur? it had been good for me to have been there still: now
therefor let me see the king' face; and if there be ani iniqu in
me, let him kill me.

14:33 So joab came to the king, and told him: and when he had called
for absalom, he came to the king, and bow himself on hi face to the
ground befor the king: and the king kiss absalom.

15:1 and it came to pass after this, that absalom prepar him
chariot and horses, and fifti men to run befor him.

15:2 and absalom rose up early, and stood besid the way of the gate:
and it wa so, that when ani man that had a controversi came to the
k for judgment, then absalom call unto him, and said, Of what
citi art thou? and he said, thi servant is of one of the tribe of
israel.

15:3 and absalom said unto him, see, thi matter are good and right;
but there is no man deput of the king to hear thee.

15:4 absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judg in the land,
that everi man which hath ani suit or caus might come unto me, and i
would do him justice!  15:5 and it wa so, that when ani man came nigh
to him to do him obeisance, he put forth hi hand, and took him, and
kiss him.

15:6 and on thi manner did absalom to all israel that came to the
k for judgment: so absalom stole the heart of the men of israel.

15:7 and it came to pass after forti years, that absalom said unto the
king, I pray thee, let me go and pay my vow, which I have vow unto
th lord, in hebron.

15:8 for thi servant vow a vow while I abod at geshur in syria,
saying, If the lord shall bring me again inde to jerusalem, then i
wil serv the lord.

15:9 and the king said unto him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to
hebron.

15:10 but absalom sent spi throughout all the tribe of israel,
saying, As soon as ye hear the sound of the trumpet, then ye shall
say, absalom reigneth in hebron.

15:11 and with absalom went two hundr men out of jerusalem, that
wer called; and they went in their simplicity, and they knew not any
thing.

15:12 and absalom sent for ahithophel the gilonite, david's
counsellor, from hi city, even from giloh, while he offered
sacrifices. and the conspiraci wa strong; for the peopl increased
continu with absalom.

15:13 and there came a messeng to david, saying, the heart of the
men of israel are after absalom.

15:14 and david said unto all hi servant that were with him at
jerusalem, arise, and let us flee; for we shall not els escap from
absalom: make speed to depart, lest he overtak us suddenly, and bring
evil upon us, and smite the citi with the edg of the sword.

15:15 and the king' servant said unto the king, behold, thi servants
ar readi to do whatsoev my lord the king shall appoint.

15:16 and the king went forth, and all hi household after him. and
th king left ten women, which were concubines, to keep the house.

15:17 and the king went forth, and all the peopl after him, and
tarri in a place that wa far off.

15:18 and all hi servant pass on besid him; and all the
cherethites, and all the pelethites, and all the gittites, six hundred
men which came after him from gath, pass on befor the king.

15:19 then said the king to ittai the gittite, wherefor goest thou
also with us? return to thi place, and abid with the king: for thou
art a stranger, and also an exile.

15:20 wherea thou camest but yesterday, should I thi day make thee
go up and down with us? see I go whither I may, return thou, and
tak back thi brethren: merci and truth be with thee.

15:21 and ittai answer the king, and said, As the lord liveth, and
a my lord the king liveth, sure in what place my lord the king
shal be, whether in death or life, even there also will thi servant
be.

15:22 and david said to ittai, Go and pass over. and ittai the gittite
pass over, and all hi men, and all the littl one that were with
him.

15:23 and all the countri wept with a loud voice, and all the people
pass over: the king also himself pass over the brook kidron, and
al the peopl pass over, toward the way of the wilderness.

15:24 and lo zadok also, and all the levit were with him, bearing
th ark of the coven of god: and they set down the ark of god; and
abiathar went up, until all the peopl had done pass out of the
city.

15:25 and the king said unto zadok, carri back the ark of god into the
city: if I shall find favour in the eye of the lord, he will bring me
again, and shew me both it, and hi habitation: 15:26 but if he thus
say, I have no delight in thee; behold, here am I, let him do to me as
seemeth good unto him.

15:27 the king said also unto zadok the priest, art not thou a seer?
return into the citi in peace, and your two son with you, ahimaaz thy
son, and jonathan the son of abiathar.

15:28 see, I will tarri in the plain of the wilderness, until there
com word from you to certifi me.

15:29 zadok therefor and abiathar carri the ark of god again to
jerusalem: and they tarri there.

15:30 and david went up by the ascent of mount olivet, and wept as he
went up, and had hi head covered, and he went barefoot: and all the
peopl that wa with him cover everi man hi head, and they went up,
weep as they went up.

15:31 and one told david, saying, ahithophel is among the conspirators
with absalom. and david said, O lord, I pray thee, turn the counsel of
ahithophel into foolishness.

15:32 and it came to pass, that when david wa come to the top of the
mount, where he worship god, behold, hushai the archit came to
meet him with hi coat rent, and earth upon hi head: 15:33 unto whom
david said, If thou passest on with me, then thou shalt be a burden
unto me: 15:34 but if thou return to the city, and say unto absalom, i
wil be thi servant, O king; as I have been thi father' servant
hitherto, so will I now also be thi servant: then mayest thou for me
defeat the counsel of ahithophel.

15:35 and hast thou not there with thee zadok and abiathar the
priests?  therefor it shall be, that what thing soever thou shalt
hear out of the king' house, thou shalt tell it to zadok and abiathar
th priests.

15:36 behold, they have there with them their two sons, ahimaaz
zadok' son, and jonathan abiathar' son; and by them ye shall send
unto me everi thing that ye can hear.

15:37 So hushai david' friend came into the city, and absalom came
into jerusalem.

16:1 and when david wa a littl past the top of the hill, behold,
ziba the servant of mephibosheth met him, with a coupl of asses
saddled, and upon them two hundr loav of bread, and an hundred
bunch of raisins, and an hundr of summer fruits, and a bottl of
wine.

16:2 and the king said unto ziba, what meanest thou by these? and ziba
said, the ass be for the king' household to ride on; and the bread
and summer fruit for the young men to eat; and the wine, that such as
b faint in the wilder may drink.

16:3 and the king said, and where is thi master' son? and ziba said
unto the king, behold, he abideth at jerusalem: for he said, To day
shal the hous of israel restor me the kingdom of my father.

16:4 then said the king to ziba, behold, thine are all that pertained
unto mephibosheth. and ziba said, I humbl beseech thee that I may
find grace in thi sight, my lord, O king.

16:5 and when king david came to bahurim, behold, thenc came out a
man of the famili of the hous of saul, whose name wa shimei, the son
of gera: he came forth, and curs still as he came.

16:6 and he cast stone at david, and at all the servant of king
david: and all the peopl and all the mighti men were on hi right
hand and on hi left.

16:7 and thu said shimei when he cursed, come out, come out, thou
bloodi man, and thou man of belial: 16:8 the lord hath return upon
the all the blood of the hous of saul, in whose stead thou hast
reigned; and the lord hath deliv the kingdom into the hand of
absalom thi son: and, behold, thou art taken in thi mischief, because
th art a bloodi man.

16:9 then said abishai the son of zeruiah unto the king, whi should
thi dead dog curs my lord the king? let me go over, I pray thee, and
tak off hi head.

16:10 and the king said, what have I to do with you, ye son of
zeruiah?  so let him curse, becaus the lord hath said unto him, curse
david. who shall then say, wherefor hast thou done so?  16:11 and
david said to abishai, and to all hi servants, behold, my son, which
cam forth of my bowels, seeketh my life: how much more now may this
benjamit do it? let him alone, and let him curse; for the lord hath
bidden him.

16:12 It may be that the lord will look on mine affliction, and that
th lord will requit me good for hi curs thi day.

16:13 and as david and hi men went by the way, shimei went along on
th hill' side over against him, and curs as he went, and threw
ston at him, and cast dust.

16:14 and the king, and all the peopl that were with him, came weary,
and refresh themselv there.

16:15 and absalom, and all the peopl the men of israel, came to
jerusalem, and ahithophel with him.

16:16 and it came to pass, when hushai the archite, david' friend,
wa come unto absalom, that hushai said unto absalom, god save the
king, god save the king.

16:17 and absalom said to hushai, Is thi thi kind to thi friend?
whi wentest thou not with thi friend?  16:18 and hushai said unto
absalom, nay; but whom the lord, and thi people, and all the men of
israel, choose, hi will I be, and with him will I abide.

16:19 and again, whom should I serve? should I not serv in the
pres of hi son? as I have serv in thi father' presence, so
wil I be in thi presence.

16:20 then said absalom to ahithophel, give counsel among you what we
shal do.

16:21 and ahithophel said unto absalom, Go in unto thi father's
concubines, which he hath left to keep the house; and all israel shall
hear that thou art abhor of thi father: then shall the hand of all
that are with thee be strong.

16:22 So they spread absalom a tent upon the top of the house; and
absalom went in unto hi father' concubin in the sight of all
israel.

16:23 and the counsel of ahithophel, which he counsel in those
days, wa as if a man had enquir at the oracl of god: so wa all
th counsel of ahithophel both with david and with absalom.

17:1 moreov ahithophel said unto absalom, let me now choos out
twelv thousand men, and I will aris and pursu after david this
night: 17:2 and I will come upon him while he is weari and weak
handed, and will make him afraid: and all the peopl that are with him
shal flee; and I will smite the king only: 17:3 and I will bring back
al the peopl unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all
returned: so all the peopl shall be in peace.

17:4 and the say pleas absalom well, and all the elder of
israel.

17:5 then said absalom, call now hushai the archit also, and let us
hear likewis what he saith.

17:6 and when hushai wa come to absalom, absalom spake unto him,
saying, ahithophel hath spoken after thi manner: shall we do after
hi saying? if not; speak thou.

17:7 and hushai said unto absalom, the counsel that ahithophel hath
given is not good at thi time.

17:8 for, said hushai, thou knowest thi father and hi men, that they
b mighti men, and they be chafe in their minds, as a bear rob of
her whelp in the field: and thi father is a man of war, and will not
lodg with the people.

17:9 behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it
wil come to pass, when some of them be overthrown at the first, that
whosoev heareth it will say, there is a slaughter among the people
that follow absalom.

17:10 and he also that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a
lion, shall utterli melt: for all israel knoweth that thi father is a
mighti man, and they which be with him are valiant men.

17:11 therefor I counsel that all israel be gener gather unto
thee, from dan even to beersheba, as the sand that is by the sea for
multitude; and that thou go to battl in thine own person.

17:12 So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found,
and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of
him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so
much as one.

17:13 moreover, if he be gotten into a city, then shall all israel
br rope to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until
ther be not one small stone found there.

17:14 and absalom and all the men of israel said, the counsel of
hushai the archit is better than the counsel of ahithophel. for the
lord had appoint to defeat the good counsel of ahithophel, to the
int that the lord might bring evil upon absalom.

17:15 then said hushai unto zadok and to abiathar the priests, thus
and thu did ahithophel counsel absalom and the elder of israel; and
thu and thu have I counselled.

17:16 now therefor send quickly, and tell david, saying, lodg not
thi night in the plain of the wilderness, but speedili pass over;
lest the king be swallow up, and all the peopl that are with him.

17:17 now jonathan and ahimaaz stay by enrogel; for they might not
b seen to come into the city: and a wench went and told them; and
they went and told king david.

17:18 nevertheless a lad saw them, and told absalom: but they went
both of them away quickly, and came to a man' hous in bahurim, which
had a well in hi court; whither they went down.

17:19 and the woman took and spread a cover over the well' mouth,
and spread ground corn thereon; and the thing wa not known.

17:20 and when absalom' servant came to the woman to the house, they
said, where is ahimaaz and jonathan? and the woman said unto them,
they be gone over the brook of water. and when they had sought and
could not find them, they return to jerusalem.

17:21 and it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up
out of the well, and went and told king david, and said unto david,
arise, and pass quickli over the water: for thu hath ahithophel
counsel against you.

17:22 then david arose, and all the peopl that were with him, and
they pass over jordan: by the morn light there lack not one of
them that wa not gone over jordan.

17:23 and when ahithophel saw that hi counsel wa not followed, he
saddl hi ass, and arose, and gat him home to hi house, to his
city, and put hi household in order, and hang himself, and died,
and wa buri in the sepulchr of hi father.

17:24 then david came to mahanaim. and absalom pass over jordan, he
and all the men of israel with him.

17:25 and absalom made amasa captain of the host instead of joab:
which amasa wa a man' son, whose name wa ithra an israelite, that
went in to abigail the daughter of nahash, sister to zeruiah joab's
mother.

17:26 So israel and absalom pitch in the land of gilead.

17:27 and it came to pass, when david wa come to mahanaim, that shobi
th son of nahash of rabbah of the children of ammon, and machir the
son of ammiel of lodebar, and barzillai the gileadit of rogelim,
17:28 brought beds, and basons, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and
barley, and flour, and parch corn, and beans, and lentiles, and
parch pulse, 17:29 and honey, and butter, and sheep, and chees of
kine, for david, and for the peopl that were with him, to eat: for
they said, the peopl is hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the
wilderness.

18:1 and david number the peopl that were with him, and set
captain of thousands, and captain of hundr over them.

18:2 and david sent forth a third part of the peopl under the hand of
joab, and a third part under the hand of abishai the son of zeruiah,
joab' brother, and a third part under the hand of ittai the gittite.
and the king said unto the people, I will sure go forth with you
myself also.

18:3 but the peopl answered, thou shalt not go forth: for if we flee
away, they will not care for us; neither if half of us die, will they
car for us: but now thou art worth ten thousand of us: therefor now
it is better that thou succour us out of the city.

18:4 and the king said unto them, what seemeth you best I will do. and
th king stood by the gate side, and all the peopl came out by
hundr and by thousands.

18:5 and the king command joab and abishai and ittai, saying, deal
gent for my sake with the young man, even with absalom. and all the
peopl heard when the king gave all the captain charg concerning
absalom.

18:6 So the peopl went out into the field against israel: and the
battl wa in the wood of ephraim; 18:7 where the peopl of israel
wer slain befor the servant of david, and there wa there a great
slaught that day of twenti thousand men.

18:8 for the battl wa there scatter over the face of all the
country: and the wood devour more peopl that day than the sword
devoured.

18:9 and absalom met the servant of david. and absalom rode upon a
mule, and the mule went under the thick bough of a great oak, and his
head caught hold of the oak, and he wa taken up between the heaven
and the earth; and the mule that wa under him went away.

18:10 and a certain man saw it, and told joab, and said, behold, I saw
absalom hang in an oak.

18:11 and joab said unto the man that told him, and, behold, thou
sawest him, and whi didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and
i would have given thee ten shekel of silver, and a girdle.

18:12 and the man said unto joab, though I should receiv a thousand
shekel of silver in mine hand, yet would I not put forth mine hand
against the king' son: for in our hear the king charg thee and
abishai and ittai, saying, bewar that none touch the young man
absalom.

18:13 otherwis I should have wrought falsehood against mine own life:
for there is no matter hid from the king, and thou thyself wouldest
hav set thyself against me.

18:14 then said joab, I may not tarri thu with thee. and he took
thre dart in hi hand, and thrust them through the heart of absalom,
whil he wa yet aliv in the midst of the oak.

18:15 and ten young men that bare joab' armour compass about and
smot absalom, and slew him.

18:16 and joab blew the trumpet, and the peopl return from pursuing
aft israel: for joab held back the people.

18:17 and they took absalom, and cast him into a great pit in the
wood, and laid a veri great heap of stone upon him: and all israel
fl everi one to hi tent.

18:18 now absalom in hi lifetim had taken and rear up for himself
a pillar, which is in the king' dale: for he said, I have no son to
keep my name in remembrance: and he call the pillar after hi own
name: and it is call unto thi day, absalom' place.

18:19 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok, let me now run, and bear the
k tidings, how that the lord hath aveng him of hi enemies.

18:20 and joab said unto him, thou shalt not bear tide thi day,
but thou shalt bear tide anoth day: but thi day thou shalt bear
no tidings, becaus the king' son is dead.

18:21 then said joab to cushi, Go tell the king what thou hast seen.
and cushi bow himself unto joab, and ran.

18:22 then said ahimaaz the son of zadok yet again to joab, but
howsoever, let me, I pray thee, also run after cushi. and joab said,
wherefor wilt thou run, my son, see that thou hast no tidings
ready?  18:23 but howsoever, said he, let me run. and he said unto
him, run. then ahimaaz ran by the way of the plain, and overran cushi.

18:24 and david sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to
th roof over the gate unto the wall, and lift up hi eyes, and
looked, and behold a man run alone.

18:25 and the watchman cried, and told the king. and the king said, if
h be alone, there is tide in hi mouth. and he came apace, and
drew near.

18:26 and the watchman saw anoth man running: and the watchman
cal unto the porter, and said, behold anoth man run alone.
and the king said, He also bringeth tidings.

18:27 and the watchman said, Me thinketh the run of the foremost
i like the run of ahimaaz the son of zadok. and the king said, he
i a good man, and cometh with good tidings.

18:28 and ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, all is well. and he
fel down to the earth upon hi face befor the king, and said,
bless be the lord thi god, which hath deliv up the men that
lift up their hand against my lord the king.

18:29 and the king said, Is the young man absalom safe? and ahimaaz
answered, when joab sent the king' servant, and me thi servant, I saw
a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.

18:30 and the king said unto him, turn aside, and stand here. and he
turn aside, and stood still.

18:31 and, behold, cushi came; and cushi said, tidings, my lord the
king: for the lord hath aveng thee thi day of all them that rose up
against thee.

18:32 and the king said unto cushi, Is the young man absalom safe? and
cushi answered, the enemi of my lord the king, and all that rise
against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.

18:33 and the king wa much moved, and went up to the chamber over the
gate, and wept: and as he went, thu he said, O my son absalom, my
son, my son absalom! would god I had die for thee, O absalom, my son,
mi son!  19:1 and it wa told joab, behold, the king weepeth and
mourneth for absalom.

19:2 and the victori that day wa turn into mourn unto all the
people: for the peopl heard say that day how the king wa griev for
hi son.

19:3 and the peopl gat them by stealth that day into the city, as
peopl be asham steal away when they flee in battle.

19:4 but the king cover hi face, and the king cri with a loud
voice, O my son absalom, O absalom, my son, my son!  19:5 and joab
cam into the hous to the king, and said, thou hast shame thi day
th face of all thi servants, which thi day have save thi life, and
th live of thi son and of thi daughters, and the live of thy
wives, and the live of thi concubines; 19:6 In that thou lovest thine
enemies, and hatest thi friends. for thou hast declar thi day, that
thou regardest neither princ nor servants: for thi day I perceive,
that if absalom had lived, and all we had die thi day, then it had
pleas thee well.

19:7 now therefor arise, go forth, and speak comfort unto thy
servants: for I swear by the lord, if thou go not forth, there will
not tarri one with thee thi night: and that will be wors unto thee
than all the evil that befel thee from thi youth until now.

19:8 then the king arose, and sat in the gate. and they told unto all
th people, saying, behold, the king doth sit in the gate. and all the
peopl came befor the king: for israel had fled everi man to his
tent.

19:9 and all the peopl were at strife throughout all the tribe of
israel, saying, the king save us out of the hand of our enemies, and
h deliv us out of the hand of the philistines; and now he is fled
out of the land for absalom.

19:10 and absalom, whom we anoint over us, is dead in battle. now
therefor whi speak ye not a word of bring the king back?  19:11
and king david sent to zadok and to abiathar the priests, saying,
speak unto the elder of judah, saying, whi are ye the last to bring
th king back to hi house? see the speech of all israel is come to
th king, even to hi house.

19:12 Ye are my brethren, ye are my bone and my flesh: wherefor then
ar ye the last to bring back the king?  19:13 and say ye to amasa,
art thou not of my bone, and of my flesh? god do so to me, and more
also, if thou be not captain of the host befor me continu in the
room of joab.

19:14 and he bow the heart of all the men of judah, even as the
heart of one man; so that they sent thi word unto the king, return
thou, and all thi servants.

19:15 So the king returned, and came to jordan. and judah came to
gilgal, to go to meet the king, to conduct the king over jordan.

19:16 and shimei the son of gera, a benjamite, which wa of bahurim,
hast and came down with the men of judah to meet king david.

19:17 and there were a thousand men of benjamin with him, and ziba the
serv of the hous of saul, and hi fifteen son and hi twenty
serv with him; and they went over jordan befor the king.

19:18 and there went over a ferri boat to carri over the king's
household, and to do what he thought good. and shimei the son of gera
fel down befor the king, as he wa come over jordan; 19:19 and said
unto the king, let not my lord imput iniqu unto me, neither do
thou rememb that which thi servant did pervers the day that my
lord the king went out of jerusalem, that the king should take it to
hi heart.

19:20 for thi servant doth know that I have sinned: therefore, behold,
i am come the first thi day of all the hous of joseph to go down to
meet my lord the king.

19:21 but abishai the son of zeruiah answer and said, shall not
shimei be put to death for this, becaus he curs the lord's
anointed?  19:22 and david said, what have I to do with you, ye sons
of zeruiah, that ye should thi day be adversari unto me? shall
ther ani man be put to death thi day in israel? for do not I know
that I am thi day king over israel?  19:23 therefor the king said
unto shimei, thou shalt not die. and the king sware unto him.

19:24 and mephibosheth the son of saul came down to meet the king, and
had neither dress hi feet, nor trim hi beard, nor wash his
clothes, from the day the king depart until the day he came again in
peace.

19:25 and it came to pass, when he wa come to jerusalem to meet the
king, that the king said unto him, wherefor wentest not thou with me,
mephibosheth?  19:26 and he answered, My lord, O king, my servant
deceiv me: for thi servant said, I will saddl me an ass, that I may
rid thereon, and go to the king; becaus thi servant is lame.

19:27 and he hath slander thi servant unto my lord the king; but my
lord the king is as an angel of god: do therefor what is good in
thin eyes.

19:28 for all of my father' hous were but dead men befor my lord
th king: yet didst thou set thi servant among them that did eat at
thin own table. what right therefor have I yet to cri ani more unto
th king?  19:29 and the king said unto him, whi speakest thou any
mor of thi matters? I have said, thou and ziba divid the land.

19:30 and mephibosheth said unto the king, yea, let him take all,
forasmuch as my lord the king is come again in peac unto hi own
house.

19:31 and barzillai the gileadit came down from rogelim, and went
ov jordan with the king, to conduct him over jordan.

19:32 now barzillai wa a veri age man, even fourscor year old: and
h had provid the king of susten while he lay at mahanaim; for
h wa a veri great man.

19:33 and the king said unto barzillai, come thou over with me, and i
wil feed thee with me in jerusalem.

19:34 and barzillai said unto the king, how long have I to live, that
i should go up with the king unto jerusalem?  19:35 I am thi day
fourscor year old: and can I discern between good and evil? can thy
serv tast what I eat or what I drink? can I hear ani more the
voic of sing men and sing women? wherefor then should thy
serv be yet a burden unto my lord the king?  19:36 thi servant will
go a littl way over jordan with the king: and whi should the king
recompens it me with such a reward?  19:37 let thi servant, I pray
thee, turn back again, that I may die in mine own city, and be buried
bi the grave of my father and of my mother. but behold thi servant
chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what
shal seem good unto thee.

19:38 and the king answered, chimham shall go over with me, and I will
do to him that which shall seem good unto thee: and whatsoev thou
shalt requir of me, that will I do for thee.

19:39 and all the peopl went over jordan. and when the king wa come
over, the king kiss barzillai, and bless him; and he return unto
hi own place.

19:40 then the king went on to gilgal, and chimham went on with him:
and all the peopl of judah conduct the king, and also half the
peopl of israel.

19:41 and, behold, all the men of israel came to the king, and said
unto the king, whi have our brethren the men of judah stolen thee
away, and have brought the king, and hi household, and all david's
men with him, over jordan?  19:42 and all the men of judah answered
th men of israel, becaus the king is near of kin to us: wherefore
then be ye angri for thi matter? have we eaten at all of the king's
cost? or hath he given us ani gift?  19:43 and the men of israel
answ the men of judah, and said, We have ten part in the king,
and we have also more right in david than ye: whi then did ye despise
us, that our advic should not be first had in bring back our king?
and the word of the men of judah were fiercer than the word of the
men of israel.

20:1 and there happen to be there a man of belial, whose name was
sheba, the son of bichri, a benjamite: and he blew a trumpet, and
said, We have no part in david, neither have we inherit in the son
of jesse: everi man to hi tents, O israel.

20:2 So everi man of israel went up from after david, and followed
sheba the son of bichri: but the men of judah clave unto their king,
from jordan even to jerusalem.

20:3 and david came to hi hous at jerusalem; and the king took the
ten women hi concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put
them in ward, and fed them, but went not in unto them. So they were
shut up unto the day of their death, live in widowhood.

20:4 then said the king to amasa, assembl me the men of judah within
thre days, and be thou here present.

20:5 So amasa went to assembl the men of judah: but he tarri longer
than the set time which he had appoint him.

20:6 and david said to abishai, now shall sheba the son of bichri do
u more harm than did absalom: take thou thi lord' servants, and
pursu after him, lest he get him fenc cities, and escap us.

20:7 and there went out after him joab' men, and the cherethites, and
th pelethites, and all the mighti men: and they went out of
jerusalem, to pursu after sheba the son of bichri.

20:8 when they were at the great stone which is in gibeon, amasa went
befor them. and joab' garment that he had put on wa gird unto
him, and upon it a girdl with a sword fasten upon hi loin in the
sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.

20:9 and joab said to amasa, art thou in health, my brother? and joab
took amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.

20:10 but amasa took no heed to the sword that wa in joab' hand: so
h smote him therewith in the fifth rib, and shed out hi bowel to
th ground, and struck him not again; and he died. So joab and abishai
hi brother pursu after sheba the son of bichri.

20:11 and one of joab' men stood by him, and said, He that favoureth
joab, and he that is for david, let him go after joab.

20:12 and amasa wallow in blood in the midst of the highway. and
when the man saw that all the peopl stood still, he remov amasa out
of the highway into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, when he saw
that everi one that came by him stood still.

20:13 when he wa remov out of the highway, all the peopl went on
aft joab, to pursu after sheba the son of bichri.

20:14 and he went through all the tribe of israel unto abel, and to
bethmaachah, and all the berites: and they were gather together, and
went also after him.

20:15 and they came and besieg him in abel of bethmaachah, and they
cast up a bank against the city, and it stood in the trench: and all
th peopl that were with joab batter the wall, to throw it down.

20:16 then cri a wise woman out of the city, hear, hear; say, I pray
you, unto joab, come near hither, that I may speak with thee.

20:17 and when he wa come near unto her, the woman said, art thou
joab?  and he answered, I am he. then she said unto him, hear the
word of thine handmaid. and he answered, I do hear.

20:18 then she spake, saying, they were wont to speak in old time,
saying, they shall sure ask counsel at abel: and so they end the
matter.

20:19 I am one of them that are peaceabl and faith in israel: thou
seekest to destroy a citi and a mother in israel: whi wilt thou
swallow up the inherit of the lord?  20:20 and joab answer and
said, far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or
destroy.

20:21 the matter is not so: but a man of mount ephraim, sheba the son
of bichri by name, hath lift up hi hand against the king, even
against david: deliv him only, and I will depart from the city. and
th woman said unto joab, behold, hi head shall be thrown to thee
ov the wall.

20:22 then the woman went unto all the peopl in her wisdom. and they
cut off the head of sheba the son of bichri, and cast it out to joab.
and he blew a trumpet, and they retir from the city, everi man to
hi tent. and joab return to jerusalem unto the king.

20:23 now joab wa over all the host of israel: and benaiah the son of
jehoiada wa over the cherethit and over the pelethites: 20:24 and
adoram wa over the tribute: and jehoshaphat the son of ahilud was
recorder: 20:25 and sheva wa scribe: and zadok and abiathar were the
priests: 20:26 and ira also the jairit wa a chief ruler about david.

21:1 then there wa a famin in the day of david three years, year
aft year; and david enquir of the lord. and the lord answered, it
i for saul, and for hi bloodi house, becaus he slew the gibeonites.

21:2 and the king call the gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the
gibeonit were not of the children of israel, but of the remnant of
th amorites; and the children of israel had sworn unto them: and saul
sought to slay them in hi zeal to the children of israel and judah.)
21:3 wherefor david said unto the gibeonites, what shall I do for
you?  and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the
inherit of the lord?  21:4 and the gibeonit said unto him, we
wil have no silver nor gold of saul, nor of hi house; neither for us
shalt thou kill ani man in israel. and he said, what ye shall say,
that will I do for you.

21:5 and they answer the king, the man that consum us, and that
devis against us that we should be destroy from remain in any
of the coast of israel, 21:6 let seven men of hi son be delivered
unto us, and we will hang them up unto the lord in gibeah of saul,
whom the lord did choose. and the king said, I will give them.

21:7 but the king spare mephibosheth, the son of jonathan the son of
saul, becaus of the lord' oath that wa between them, between david
and jonathan the son of saul.

21:8 but the king took the two son of rizpah the daughter of aiah,
whom she bare unto saul, armoni and mephibosheth; and the five son of
mich the daughter of saul, whom she brought up for adriel the son of
barzillai the meholathite: 21:9 and he deliv them into the hands
of the gibeonites, and they hang them in the hill befor the lord:
and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the day of
harvest, in the first days, in the begin of barley harvest.

21:10 and rizpah the daughter of aiah took sackcloth, and spread it
for her upon the rock, from the begin of harvest until water
drop upon them out of heaven, and suffer neither the bird of the
air to rest on them by day, nor the beast of the field by night.

21:11 and it wa told david what rizpah the daughter of aiah, the
concubin of saul, had done.

21:12 and david went and took the bone of saul and the bone of
jonathan hi son from the men of jabeshgilead, which had stolen them
from the street of bethshan, where the philistin had hang them,
when the philistin had slain saul in gilboa: 21:13 and he brought up
from thenc the bone of saul and the bone of jonathan hi son; and
they gather the bone of them that were hanged.

21:14 and the bone of saul and jonathan hi son buri they in the
countri of benjamin in zelah, in the sepulchr of kish hi father: and
they perform all that the king commanded. and after that god was
intr for the land.

21:15 moreov the philistin had yet war again with israel; and
david went down, and hi servant with him, and fought against the
philistines: and david wax faint.

21:16 and ishbibenob, which wa of the son of the giant, the weight
of whose spear weigh three hundr shekel of brass in weight, he
b gird with a new sword, thought to have slain david.

21:17 but abishai the son of zeruiah succour him, and smote the
philistine, and kill him. then the men of david sware unto him,
saying, thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench
not the light of israel.

21:18 and it came to pass after this, that there wa again a battle
with the philistin at gob: then sibbechai the hushathit slew saph,
which wa of the son of the giant.

21:19 and there wa again a battl in gob with the philistines, where
elhanan the son of jaareoregim, a bethlehemite, slew the brother of
goliath the gittite, the staff of whose spear wa like a weaver's
beam.

21:20 and there wa yet a battl in gath, where wa a man of great
stature, that had on everi hand six fingers, and on everi foot six
toes, four and twenti in number; and he also wa born to the giant.

21:21 and when he defi israel, jonathan the son of shimeah the
broth of david slew him.

21:22 these four were born to the giant in gath, and fell by the hand
of david, and by the hand of hi servants.

22:1 and david spake unto the lord the word of thi song in the day
that the lord had deliv him out of the hand of all hi enemies,
and out of the hand of saul: 22:2 and he said, the lord is my rock,
and my fortress, and my deliverer; 22:3 the god of my rock; in him
wil I trust: he is my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high
tower, and my refuge, my saviour; thou savest me from violence.

22:4 I will call on the lord, who is worthi to be praised: so shall i
b save from mine enemies.

22:5 when the wave of death compass me, the flood of ungodli men
mad me afraid; 22:6 the sorrow of hell compass me about; the
snar of death prevent me; 22:7 In my distress I call upon the
lord, and cri to my god: and he did hear my voic out of hi temple,
and my cri did enter into hi ears.

22:8 then the earth shook and trembled; the foundat of heaven
mov and shook, becaus he wa wroth.

22:9 there went up a smoke out of hi nostrils, and fire out of his
mouth devoured: coal were kindl by it.

22:10 He bow the heaven also, and came down; and dark wa under
hi feet.

22:11 and he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: and he wa seen upon the
w of the wind.

22:12 and he made dark pavilion round about him, dark waters, and
thick cloud of the skies.

22:13 through the bright befor him were coal of fire kindled.

22:14 the lord thunder from heaven, and the most high utter his
voice.

22:15 and he sent out arrows, and scatter them; lightning, and
discomfit them.

22:16 and the channel of the sea appeared, the foundat of the
world were discovered, at the rebuk of the lord, at the blast of
th breath of hi nostrils.

22:17 He sent from above, he took me; he drew me out of mani waters;
22:18 He deliv me from my strong enemy, and from them that hated
me: for they were too strong for me.

22:19 they prevent me in the day of my calamity: but the lord wa my
stay.

22:20 He brought me forth also into a larg place: he deliv me,
becaus he delight in me.

22:21 the lord reward me accord to my righteousness: accord to
th clean of my hand hath he recompens me.

22:22 for I have kept the way of the lord, and have not wickedly
depart from my god.

22:23 for all hi judgment were befor me: and as for hi statutes, i
did not depart from them.

22:24 I wa also upright befor him, and have kept myself from mine
iniquity.

22:25 therefor the lord hath recompens me accord to my
righteousness; accord to my clean in hi eye sight.

22:26 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merciful, and with the
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright.

22:27 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward
th wilt shew thyself unsavoury.

22:28 and the afflict peopl thou wilt save: but thine eye are upon
th haughty, that thou mayest bring them down.

22:29 for thou art my lamp, O lord: and the lord will lighten my
darkness.

22:30 for by thee I have run through a troop: by my god have I leaped
ov a wall.

22:31 As for god, hi way is perfect; the word of the lord is tried:
h is a buckler to all them that trust in him.

22:32 for who is god, save the lord? and who is a rock, save our god?
22:33 god is my strength and power: and he maketh my way perfect.

22:34 He maketh my feet like hinds' feet: and setteth me upon my high
places.

22:35 He teacheth my hand to war; so that a bow of steel is broken by
min arms.

22:36 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvation: and thy
gentl hath made me great.

22:37 thou hast enlarg my step under me; so that my feet did not
slip.

22:38 I have pursu mine enemies, and destroy them; and turn not
again until I had consum them.

22:39 and I have consum them, and wound them, that they could not
arise: yea, they are fallen under my feet.

22:40 for thou hast gird me with strength to battle: them that rose
up against me hast thou subdu under me.

22:41 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemies, that I might
destroy them that hate me.

22:42 they looked, but there wa none to save; even unto the lord, but
h answer them not.

22:43 then did I beat them as small as the dust of the earth, I did
stamp them as the mire of the street, and did spread them abroad.

22:44 thou also hast deliv me from the strive of my people,
th hast kept me to be head of the heathen: a peopl which I knew not
shal serv me.

22:45 stranger shall submit themselv unto me: as soon as they hear,
they shall be obedi unto me.

22:46 stranger shall fade away, and they shall be afraid out of their
clos places.

22:47 the lord liveth; and bless be my rock; and exalt be the god
of the rock of my salvation.

22:48 It is god that avengeth me, and that bringeth down the people
und me.

22:49 and that bringeth me forth from mine enemies: thou also hast
lift me up on high abov them that rose up against me: thou hast
deliv me from the violent man.

22:50 therefor I will give thank unto thee, O lord, among the
heathen, and I will sing prais unto thi name.

22:51 He is the tower of salvat for hi king: and sheweth merci to
hi anointed, unto david, and to hi seed for evermore.

23:1 now these be the last word of david. david the son of jesse
said, and the man who wa rais up on high, the anoint of the god
of jacob, and the sweet psalmist of israel, said, 23:2 the spirit of
th lord spake by me, and hi word wa in my tongue.

23:3 the god of israel said, the rock of israel spake to me, He that
ruleth over men must be just, rule in the fear of god.

23:4 and he shall be as the light of the morning, when the sun riseth,
even a morn without clouds; as the tender grass spring out of
th earth by clear shine after rain.

23:5 although my hous be not so with god; yet he hath made with me an
everlast covenant, order in all things, and sure: for thi is all
mi salvation, and all my desire, although he make it not to grow.

23:6 but the son of belial shall be all of them as thorn thrust
away, becaus they cannot be taken with hands: 23:7 but the man that
shal touch them must be fenc with iron and the staff of a spear;
and they shall be utterli burn with fire in the same place.

23:8 these be the name of the mighti men whom david had: the
tachmonit that sat in the seat, chief among the captains; the same
wa adino the eznite: he lift up hi spear against eight hundred, whom
h slew at one time.

23:9 and after him wa eleazar the son of dodo the ahohite, one of the
thre mighti men with david, when they defi the philistin that
wer there gather togeth to battle, and the men of israel were
gon away: 23:10 He arose, and smote the philistin until hi hand
wa weary, and hi hand clave unto the sword: and the lord wrought a
great victori that day; and the peopl return after him onli to
spoil.

23:11 and after him wa shammah the son of age the hararite. and the
philistin were gather togeth into a troop, where wa a piec of
ground full of lentiles: and the peopl fled from the philistines.

23:12 but he stood in the midst of the ground, and defend it, and
slew the philistines: and the lord wrought a great victory.

23:13 and three of the thirti chief went down, and came to david in
th harvest time unto the cave of adullam: and the troop of the
philistin pitch in the valley of rephaim.

23:14 and david wa then in an hold, and the garrison of the
philistin wa then in bethlehem.

23:15 and david longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of
th water of the well of bethlehem, which is by the gate!  23:16 and
th three mighti men brake through the host of the philistines, and
drew water out of the well of bethlehem, that wa by the gate, and
took it, and brought it to david: nevertheless he would not drink
thereof, but pour it out unto the lord.

23:17 and he said, Be it far from me, O lord, that I should do this:
i not thi the blood of the men that went in jeopardi of their lives?
therefor he would not drink it. these thing did these three mighty
men.

23:18 and abishai, the brother of joab, the son of zeruiah, wa chief
among three. and he lift up hi spear against three hundred, and
slew them, and had the name among three.

23:19 wa he not most honour of three? therefor he wa their
captain: howbeit he attain not unto the first three.

23:20 and benaiah the son of jehoiada, the son of a valiant man, of
kabzeel, who had done mani acts, he slew two lionlik men of moab: he
went down also and slew a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow:
23:21 and he slew an egyptian, a goodli man: and the egyptian had a
spear in hi hand; but he went down to him with a staff, and plucked
th spear out of the egyptian' hand, and slew him with hi own spear.

23:22 these thing did benaiah the son of jehoiada, and had the name
among three mighti men.

23:23 He wa more honour than the thirty, but he attain not to
th first three. and david set him over hi guard.

23:24 asahel the brother of joab wa one of the thirty; elhanan the
son of dodo of bethlehem, 23:25 shammah the harodite, elika the
harodite, 23:26 helez the paltite, ira the son of ikkesh the tekoite,
23:27 abiez the anethothite, mebunnai the hushathite, 23:28 zalmon
th ahohite, maharai the netophathite, 23:29 heleb the son of baanah,
a netophathite, ittai the son of ribai out of gibeah of the children
of benjamin, 23:30 benaiah the pirathonite, hiddai of the brook of
gaash, 23:31 abialbon the arbathite, azmaveth the barhumite, 23:32
eliahba the shaalbonite, of the son of jashen, jonathan, 23:33
shammah the hararite, ahiam the son of sharar the hararite, 23:34
eliphelet the son of ahasbai, the son of the maachathite, eliam the
son of ahithophel the gilonite, 23:35 hezrai the carmelite, paarai the
arbite, 23:36 igal the son of nathan of zobah, bani the gadite, 23:37
zelek the ammonite, nahari the beerothite, armourbear to joab the
son of zeruiah, 23:38 ira an ithrite, gareb an ithrite, 23:39 uriah
th hittite: thirti and seven in all.

24:1 and again the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel, and
h move david against them to say, go, number israel and judah.

24:2 for the king said to joab the captain of the host, which wa with
him, Go now through all the tribe of israel, from dan even to
beersheba, and number ye the people, that I may know the number of the
people.

24:3 and joab said unto the king, now the lord thi god add unto the
people, how mani soever they be, an hundredfold, and that the eye of
mi lord the king may see it: but whi doth my lord the king delight in
thi thing?  24:4 notwithstand the king' word prevail against
joab, and against the captain of the host. and joab and the captains
of the host went out from the presenc of the king, to number the
peopl of israel.

24:5 and they pass over jordan, and pitch in aroer, on the right
sid of the citi that lieth in the midst of the river of gad, and
toward jazer: 24:6 then they came to gilead, and to the land of
tahtimhodshi; and they came to danjaan, and about to zidon, 24:7 and
cam to the strong hold of tyre, and to all the citi of the hivites,
and of the canaanites: and they went out to the south of judah, even
to beersheba.

24:8 So when they had gone through all the land, they came to
jerusalem at the end of nine month and twenti days.

24:9 and joab gave up the sum of the number of the peopl unto the
king: and there were in israel eight hundr thousand valiant men that
drew the sword; and the men of judah were five hundr thousand men.

24:10 and david' heart smote him after that he had number the
people.

and david said unto the lord, I have sin greatli in that I have
done: and now, I beseech thee, O lord, take away the iniqu of thy
servant; for I have done veri foolishly.

24:11 for when david wa up in the morning, the word of the lord came
unto the prophet gad, david' seer, saying, 24:12 Go and say unto
david, thu saith the lord, I offer thee three things; choos thee one
of them, that I may do it unto thee.

24:13 So gad came to david, and told him, and said unto him, shall
seven year of famin come unto thee in thi land? or wilt thou flee
thre month befor thine enemies, while they pursu thee? or that
ther be three days' pestil in thi land? now advise, and see what
answ I shall return to him that sent me.

24:14 and david said unto gad, I am in a great strait: let us fall now
into the hand of the lord; for hi merci are great: and let me not
fal into the hand of man.

24:15 So the lord sent a pestil upon israel from the morn even
to the time appointed: and there die of the peopl from dan even to
beersheba seventi thousand men.

24:16 and when the angel stretch out hi hand upon jerusalem to
destroy it, the lord repent him of the evil, and said to the angel
that destroy the people, It is enough: stay now thine hand. and the
angel of the lord wa by the threshingplac of araunah the jebusite.

24:17 and david spake unto the lord when he saw the angel that smote
th people, and said, lo, I have sinned, and I have done wickedly: but
thes sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray thee, be
against me, and against my father' house.

24:18 and gad came that day to david, and said unto him, Go up, rear
an altar unto the lord in the threshingfloor of araunah the jebusite.

24:19 and david, accord to the say of gad, went up as the lord
commanded.

24:20 and araunah looked, and saw the king and hi servant come on
toward him: and araunah went out, and bow himself befor the king on
hi face upon the ground.

24:21 and araunah said, wherefor is my lord the king come to his
servant?  and david said, To buy the threshingfloor of thee, to build
an altar unto the lord, that the plagu may be stay from the people.

24:22 and araunah said unto david, let my lord the king take and offer
up what seemeth good unto him: behold, here be oxen for burnt
sacrifice, and thresh instrument and other instrument of the oxen
for wood.

24:23 all these thing did araunah, as a king, give unto the king. and
araunah said unto the king, the lord thi god accept thee.

24:24 and the king said unto araunah, nay; but I will sure buy it of
the at a price: neither will I offer burnt offer unto the lord my
god of that which doth cost me nothing. So david bought the
threshingfloor and the oxen for fifti shekel of silver.

24:25 and david built there an altar unto the lord, and offer burnt
off and peac offerings. So the lord wa intreat for the land,
and the plagu wa stay from israel.




th first book of the kings

commonli called:

th third book of the kings


1:1 now king david wa old and stricken in years; and they covered
him with clothes, but he gat no heat.

1:2 wherefor hi servant said unto him, let there be sought for my
lord the king a young virgin: and let her stand befor the king, and
let her cherish him, and let her lie in thi bosom, that my lord the
k may get heat.

1:3 So they sought for a fair damsel throughout all the coast of
israel, and found abishag a shunammite, and brought her to the king.

1:4 and the damsel wa veri fair, and cherish the king, and
minist to him: but the king knew her not.

1:5 then adonijah the son of haggith exalt himself, saying, I will
b king: and he prepar him chariot and horsemen, and fifti men to
run befor him.

1:6 and hi father had not displeas him at ani time in saying, why
hast thou done so? and he also wa a veri goodli man; and hi mother
bar him after absalom.

1:7 and he confer with joab the son of zeruiah, and with abiathar
th priest: and they follow adonijah help him.

1:8 but zadok the priest, and benaiah the son of jehoiada, and nathan
th prophet, and shimei, and rei, and the mighti men which belong to
david, were not with adonijah.

1:9 and adonijah slew sheep and oxen and fat cattl by the stone of
zoheleth, which is by enrogel, and call all hi brethren the king's
sons, and all the men of judah the king' servants: 1:10 but nathan
th prophet, and benaiah, and the mighti men, and solomon hi brother,
h call not.

1:11 wherefor nathan spake unto bathsheba the mother of solomon,
saying, hast thou not heard that adonijah the son of haggith doth
reign, and david our lord knoweth it not?  1:12 now therefor come,
let me, I pray thee, give thee counsel, that thou mayest save thine
own life, and the life of thi son solomon.

1:13 Go and get thee in unto king david, and say unto him, didst not
thou, my lord, O king, swear unto thine handmaid, saying, assuredly
solomon thi son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?
whi then doth adonijah reign?  1:14 behold, while thou yet talkest
ther with the king, I also will come in after thee, and confirm thy
words.

1:15 and bathsheba went in unto the king into the chamber: and the
k wa veri old; and abishag the shunammit minist unto the
king.

1:16 and bathsheba bowed, and did obeis unto the king. and the
k said, what wouldest thou?  1:17 and she said unto him, My lord,
thou swarest by the lord thi god unto thine handmaid, saying,
assuredli solomon thi son shall reign after me, and he shall sit upon
mi throne.

1:18 and now, behold, adonijah reigneth; and now, my lord the king,
thou knowest it not: 1:19 and he hath slain oxen and fat cattl and
sheep in abundance, and hath call all the son of the king, and
abiathar the priest, and joab the captain of the host: but solomon thy
serv hath he not called.
