1:20 and thou, my lord, O king, the eye of all israel are upon thee,
that thou shouldest tell them who shall sit on the throne of my lord
th king after him.

1:21 otherwis it shall come to pass, when my lord the king shall
sleep with hi fathers, that I and my son solomon shall be counted
offenders.

1:22 and, lo, while she yet talk with the king, nathan the prophet
also came in.

1:23 and they told the king, saying, behold nathan the prophet. and
when he wa come in befor the king, he bow himself befor the king
with hi face to the ground.

1:24 and nathan said, My lord, O king, hast thou said, adonijah shall
reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne?  1:25 for he is gone
down thi day, and hath slain oxen and fat cattl and sheep in
abundance, and hath call all the king' sons, and the captain of
th host, and abiathar the priest; and, behold, they eat and drink
befor him, and say, god save king adonijah.

1:26 but me, even me thi servant, and zadok the priest, and benaiah
th son of jehoiada, and thi servant solomon, hath he not called.

1:27 Is thi thing done by my lord the king, and thou hast not shewed
it unto thi servant, who should sit on the throne of my lord the king
aft him?  1:28 then king david answer and said, call me bathsheba.
and she came into the king' presence, and stood befor the king.

1:29 and the king sware, and said, As the lord liveth, that hath
redeem my soul out of all distress, 1:30 even as I sware unto thee
bi the lord god of israel, saying, assuredli solomon thi son shall
reign after me, and he shall sit upon my throne in my stead; even so
wil I certainli do thi day.

1:31 then bathsheba bow with her face to the earth, and did
rever to the king, and said, let my lord king david live for ever.

1:32 and king david said, call me zadok the priest, and nathan the
prophet, and benaiah the son of jehoiada. and they came befor the
king.

1:33 the king also said unto them, take with you the servant of your
lord, and caus solomon my son to ride upon mine own mule, and bring
him down to gihon: 1:34 and let zadok the priest and nathan the
prophet anoint him there king over israel: and blow ye with the
trumpet, and say, god save king solomon.

1:35 then ye shall come up after him, that he may come and sit upon my
throne; for he shall be king in my stead: and I have appoint him to
b ruler over israel and over judah.

1:36 and benaiah the son of jehoiada answer the king, and said,
amen: the lord god of my lord the king say so too.

1:37 As the lord hath been with my lord the king, even so be he with
solomon, and make hi throne greater than the throne of my lord king
david.

1:38 So zadok the priest, and nathan the prophet, and benaiah the son
of jehoiada, and the cherethites, and the pelethites, went down, and
caus solomon to ride upon king david' mule, and brought him to
gihon.

1:39 and zadok the priest took an horn of oil out of the tabernacle,
and anoint solomon. and they blew the trumpet; and all the people
said, god save king solomon.

1:40 and all the peopl came up after him, and the peopl pipe with
pipes, and rejoic with great joy, so that the earth rent with the
sound of them.

1:41 and adonijah and all the guest that were with him heard it as
they had made an end of eating. and when joab heard the sound of the
trumpet, he said, wherefor is thi nois of the citi be in an
uproar?  1:42 and while he yet spake, behold, jonathan the son of
abiathar the priest came; and adonijah said unto him, come in; for
thou art a valiant man, and bringest good tidings.

1:43 and jonathan answer and said to adonijah, verili our lord king
david hath made solomon king.

1:44 and the king hath sent with him zadok the priest, and nathan the
prophet, and benaiah the son of jehoiada, and the cherethites, and the
pelethites, and they have caus him to ride upon the king' mule:
1:45 and zadok the priest and nathan the prophet have anoint him
k in gihon: and they are come up from thenc rejoicing, so that the
citi rang again. thi is the nois that ye have heard.

1:46 and also solomon sitteth on the throne of the kingdom.

1:47 and moreov the king' servant came to bless our lord king
david, saying, god make the name of solomon better than thi name, and
mak hi throne greater than thi throne. and the king bow himself
upon the bed.

1:48 and also thu said the king, bless be the lord god of israel,
which hath given one to sit on my throne thi day, mine eye even
se it.

1:49 and all the guest that were with adonijah were afraid, and rose
up, and went everi man hi way.

1:50 and adonijah fear becaus of solomon, and arose, and went, and
caught hold on the horn of the altar.

1:51 and it wa told solomon, saying, behold, adonijah feareth king
solomon: for, lo, he hath caught hold on the horn of the altar,
saying, let king solomon swear unto me today that he will not slay his
serv with the sword.

1:52 and solomon said, If he will shew himself a worthi man, there
shal not an hair of him fall to the earth: but if wicked shall be
found in him, he shall die.

1:53 So king solomon sent, and they brought him down from the altar.
and he came and bow himself to king solomon: and solomon said unto
him, Go to thine house.

2:1 now the day of david drew nigh that he should die; and he charged
solomon hi son, saying, 2:2 I go the way of all the earth: be thou
strong therefore, and shew thyself a man; 2:3 and keep the charg of
th lord thi god, to walk in hi ways, to keep hi statutes, and his
commandments, and hi judgments, and hi testimonies, as it is written
in the law of moses, that thou mayest prosper in all that thou doest,
and whithersoev thou turnest thyself: 2:4 that the lord may continue
hi word which he spake concern me, saying, If thi children take
he to their way, to walk befor me in truth with all their heart and
with all their soul, there shall not fail thee (said he) a man on the
thron of israel.

2:5 moreov thou knowest also what joab the son of zeruiah did to me,
and what he did to the two captain of the host of israel, unto abner
th son of ner, and unto amasa the son of jether, whom he slew, and
sh the blood of war in peace, and put the blood of war upon his
girdl that wa about hi loins, and in hi shoe that were on his
feet.

2:6 Do therefor accord to thi wisdom, and let not hi hoar head go
down to the grave in peace.

2:7 but shew kind unto the son of barzillai the gileadite, and
let them be of those that eat at thi table: for so they came to me
when I fled becaus of absalom thi brother.

2:8 and, behold, thou hast with thee shimei the son of gera, a
benjamit of bahurim, which curs me with a grievou curs in the day
when I went to mahanaim: but he came down to meet me at jordan, and i
swar to him by the lord, saying, I will not put thee to death with
th sword.

2:9 now therefor hold him not guiltless: for thou art a wise man, and
knowest what thou oughtest to do unto him; but hi hoar head bring
thou down to the grave with blood.

2:10 So david slept with hi fathers, and wa buri in the citi of
david.

2:11 and the day that david reign over israel were forti years:
seven year reign he in hebron, and thirti and three year reigned
h in jerusalem.

2:12 then sat solomon upon the throne of david hi father; and his
kingdom wa establish greatly.

2:13 and adonijah the son of haggith came to bathsheba the mother of
solomon. and she said, comest thou peaceably? and he said, peaceably.

2:14 He said moreover, I have somewhat to say unto thee. and she said,
say on.

2:15 and he said, thou knowest that the kingdom wa mine, and that all
israel set their face on me, that I should reign: howbeit the kingdom
i turn about, and is becom my brother's: for it wa hi from the
lord.

2:16 and now I ask one petit of thee, deni me not. and she said
unto him, say on.

2:17 and he said, speak, I pray thee, unto solomon the king, (for he
wil not say thee nay,) that he give me abishag the shunammit to
wife.

2:18 and bathsheba said, well; I will speak for thee unto the king.

2:19 bathsheba therefor went unto king solomon, to speak unto him for
adonijah. and the king rose up to meet her, and bow himself unto
her, and sat down on hi throne, and caus a seat to be set for the
king' mother; and she sat on hi right hand.

2:20 then she said, I desir one small petit of thee; I pray thee,
say me not nay. and the king said unto her, ask on, my mother: for i
wil not say thee nay.

2:21 and she said, let abishag the shunammit be given to adonijah thy
broth to wife.

2:22 and king solomon answer and said unto hi mother, and whi dost
thou ask abishag the shunammit for adonijah? ask for him the kingdom
also; for he is mine elder brother; even for him, and for abiathar the
priest, and for joab the son of zeruiah.

2:23 then king solomon sware by the lord, saying, god do so to me, and
mor also, if adonijah have not spoken thi word against hi own life.

2:24 now therefore, as the lord liveth, which hath establish me, and
set me on the throne of david my father, and who hath made me an
house, as he promised, adonijah shall be put to death thi day.

2:25 and king solomon sent by the hand of benaiah the son of jehoiada;
and he fell upon him that he died.

2:26 and unto abiathar the priest said the king, get thee to anathoth,
unto thine own fields; for thou art worthi of death: but I will not at
thi time put thee to death, becaus thou barest the ark of the lord
god befor david my father, and becaus thou hast been afflict in
al wherein my father wa afflicted.

2:27 So solomon thrust out abiathar from be priest unto the lord;
that he might fulfil the word of the lord, which he spake concerning
th hous of eli in shiloh.

2:28 then tide came to joab: for joab had turn after adonijah,
though he turn not after absalom. and joab fled unto the tabernacle
of the lord, and caught hold on the horn of the altar.

2:29 and it wa told king solomon that joab wa fled unto the
tabernacl of the lord; and, behold, he is by the altar. then solomon
s benaiah the son of jehoiada, saying, go, fall upon him.

2:30 and benaiah came to the tabernacl of the lord, and said unto
him, thu saith the king, come forth. and he said, nay; but I will die
here. and benaiah brought the king word again, saying, thu said joab,
and thu he answer me.

2:31 and the king said unto him, Do as he hath said, and fall upon
him, and buri him; that thou mayest take away the innoc blood,
which joab shed, from me, and from the hous of my father.

2:32 and the lord shall return hi blood upon hi own head, who fell
upon two men more righteou and better than he, and slew them with the
sword, my father david not know thereof, to wit, abner the son of
ner, captain of the host of israel, and amasa the son of jether,
captain of the host of judah.

2:33 their blood shall therefor return upon the head of joab, and
upon the head of hi seed for ever: but upon david, and upon hi seed,
and upon hi house, and upon hi throne, shall there be peac for ever
from the lord.

2:34 So benaiah the son of jehoiada went up, and fell upon him, and
slew him: and he wa buri in hi own hous in the wilderness.

2:35 and the king put benaiah the son of jehoiada in hi room over the
host: and zadok the priest did the king put in the room of abiathar.

2:36 and the king sent and call for shimei, and said unto him, build
the an hous in jerusalem, and dwell there, and go not forth thence
ani whither.

2:37 for it shall be, that on the day thou goest out, and passest over
th brook kidron, thou shalt know for certain that thou shalt surely
die: thi blood shall be upon thine own head.

2:38 and shimei said unto the king, the say is good: as my lord the
k hath said, so will thi servant do. and shimei dwelt in jerusalem
mani days.

2:39 and it came to pass at the end of three years, that two of the
serv of shimei ran away unto achish son of maachah king of gath.
and they told shimei, saying, behold, thi servant be in gath.

2:40 and shimei arose, and saddl hi ass, and went to gath to achish
to seek hi servants: and shimei went, and brought hi servant from
gath.

2:41 and it wa told solomon that shimei had gone from jerusalem to
gath, and wa come again.

2:42 and the king sent and call for shimei, and said unto him, did i
not make thee to swear by the lord, and protest unto thee, saying,
know for a certain, on the day thou goest out, and walkest abroad any
whither, that thou shalt sure die? and thou saidst unto me, the word
that I have heard is good.

2:43 whi then hast thou not kept the oath of the lord, and the
command that I have charg thee with?  2:44 the king said
moreov to shimei, thou knowest all the wicked which thine heart
i privi to, that thou didst to david my father: therefor the lord
shal return thi wicked upon thine own head; 2:45 and king solomon
shal be blessed, and the throne of david shall be establish before
th lord for ever.

2:46 So the king command benaiah the son of jehoiada; which went
out, and fell upon him, that he died. and the kingdom wa established
in the hand of solomon.

3:1 and solomon made affin with pharaoh king of egypt, and took
pharaoh' daughter, and brought her into the citi of david, until he
had made an end of build hi own house, and the hous of the lord,
and the wall of jerusalem round about.

3:2 onli the peopl sacrif in high places, becaus there wa no
hous built unto the name of the lord, until those days.

3:3 and solomon love the lord, walk in the statut of david his
father: onli he sacrif and burnt incens in high places.

3:4 and the king went to gibeon to sacrific there; for that wa the
great high place: a thousand burnt offer did solomon offer upon
that altar.

3:5 In gibeon the lord appear to solomon in a dream by night: and
god said, ask what I shall give thee.

3:6 and solomon said, thou hast shew unto thi servant david my
fath great mercy, accord as he walk befor thee in truth, and
in righteousness, and in upright of heart with thee; and thou hast
kept for him thi great kindness, that thou hast given him a son to
sit on hi throne, as it is thi day.

3:7 and now, O lord my god, thou hast made thi servant king instead of
david my father: and I am but a littl child: I know not how to go out
or come in.

3:8 and thi servant is in the midst of thi peopl which thou hast
chosen, a great people, that cannot be number nor count for
multitude.

3:9 give therefor thi servant an understand heart to judg thy
people, that I may discern between good and bad: for who is abl to
judg thi thi so great a people?  3:10 and the speech pleas the
lord, that solomon had ask thi thing.

3:11 and god said unto him, becaus thou hast ask thi thing, and
hast not ask for thyself long life; neither hast ask rich for
thyself, nor hast ask the life of thine enemies; but hast ask for
thyself understand to discern judgment; 3:12 behold, I have done
accord to thi words: lo, I have given thee a wise and an
understand heart; so that there wa none like thee befor thee,
neith after thee shall ani aris like unto thee.

3:13 and I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both
riches, and honour: so that there shall not be ani among the kings
lik unto thee all thi days.

3:14 and if thou wilt walk in my ways, to keep my statut and my
commandments, as thi father david did walk, then I will lengthen thy
days.

3:15 and solomon awoke; and, behold, it wa a dream. and he came to
jerusalem, and stood befor the ark of the coven of the lord, and
off up burnt offerings, and offer peac offerings, and made a
feast to all hi servants.

3:16 then came there two women, that were harlots, unto the king, and
stood befor him.

3:17 and the one woman said, O my lord, I and thi woman dwell in one
house; and I wa deliv of a child with her in the house.

3:18 and it came to pass the third day after that I wa delivered,
that thi woman wa deliv also: and we were together; there wa no
strang with us in the house, save we two in the house.

3:19 and thi woman' child die in the night; becaus she overlaid
it.

3:20 and she aros at midnight, and took my son from besid me, while
thin handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead
child in my bosom.

3:21 and when I rose in the morn to give my child suck, behold, it
wa dead: but when I had consid it in the morning, behold, it was
not my son, which I did bear.

3:22 and the other woman said, nay; but the live is my son, and the
dead is thi son. and thi said, no; but the dead is thi son, and the
liv is my son. thu they spake befor the king.

3:23 then said the king, the one saith, thi is my son that liveth,
and thi son is the dead: and the other saith, nay; but thi son is the
dead, and my son is the living.

3:24 and the king said, bring me a sword. and they brought a sword
befor the king.

3:25 and the king said, divid the live child in two, and give half
to the one, and half to the other.

3:26 then spake the woman whose the live child wa unto the king,
for her bowel yearn upon her son, and she said, O my lord, give her
th live child, and in no wise slay it. but the other said, let it
b neither mine nor thine, but divid it.

3:27 then the king answer and said, give her the live child, and
in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.

3:28 and all israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged;
and they fear the king: for they saw that the wisdom of god wa in
him, to do judgment.

4:1 So king solomon wa king over all israel.

4:2 and these were the princ which he had; azariah the son of zadok
th priest, 4:3 elihoreph and ahiah, the son of shisha, scribes;
jehoshaphat the son of ahilud, the recorder.

4:4 and benaiah the son of jehoiada wa over the host: and zadok and
abiathar were the priests: 4:5 and azariah the son of nathan wa over
th officers: and zabud the son of nathan wa princip officer, and
th king' friend: 4:6 and ahishar wa over the household: and
adoniram the son of abda wa over the tribute.

4:7 and solomon had twelv offic over all israel, which provided
victu for the king and hi household: each man hi month in a year
mad provision.

4:8 and these are their names: the son of hur, in mount ephraim: 4:9
the son of dekar, in makaz, and in shaalbim, and bethshemesh, and
elonbethhanan: 4:10 the son of hesed, in aruboth; to him pertained
sochoh, and all the land of hepher: 4:11 the son of abinadab, in all
th region of dor; which had taphath the daughter of solomon to wife:
4:12 baana the son of ahilud; to him pertain taanach and megiddo,
and all bethshean, which is by zartanah beneath jezreel, from
bethshean to abelmeholah, even unto the place that is beyond jokneam:
4:13 the son of geber, in ramothgilead; to him pertain the town of
jair the son of manasseh, which are in gilead; to him also pertained
th region of argob, which is in bashan, threescor great citi with
wal and brasen bars: 4:14 ahinadab the son of iddo had mahanaim:
4:15 ahimaaz wa in naphtali; he also took basmath the daughter of
solomon to wife: 4:16 baanah the son of hushai wa in asher and in
aloth: 4:17 jehoshaphat the son of paruah, in issachar: 4:18 shimei
th son of elah, in benjamin: 4:19 geber the son of uri wa in the
countri of gilead, in the countri of sihon king of the amorites, and
of Og king of bashan; and he wa the onli offic which wa in the
land.

4:20 judah and israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in
multitude, eat and drinking, and make merry.

4:21 and solomon reign over all kingdom from the river unto the
land of the philistines, and unto the border of egypt: they brought
presents, and serv solomon all the day of hi life.

4:22 and solomon' provis for one day wa thirti measur of fine
flour, and threescor measur of meal, 4:23 ten fat oxen, and twenty
oxen out of the pastures, and an hundr sheep, besid harts, and
roebucks, and fallowdeer, and fat fowl.

4:24 for he had dominion over all the region on thi side the river,
from tiphsah even to azzah, over all the king on thi side the river:
and he had peac on all side round about him.

4:25 and judah and israel dwelt safely, everi man under hi vine and
und hi fig tree, from dan even to beersheba, all the day of
solomon.

4:26 and solomon had forti thousand stall of hors for hi chariots,
and twelv thousand horsemen.

4:27 and those offic provid victual for king solomon, and for all
that came unto king solomon' table, everi man in hi month: they
lack nothing.

4:28 barley also and straw for the hors and dromedari brought they
unto the place where the offic were, everi man accord to his
charge.

4:29 and god gave solomon wisdom and understand exceed much, and
larg of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea shore.

4:30 and solomon' wisdom excel the wisdom of all the children of
th east country, and all the wisdom of egypt.

4:31 for he wa wiser than all men; than ethan the ezrahite, and
heman, and chalcol, and darda, the son of mahol: and hi fame wa in
al nation round about.

4:32 and he spake three thousand proverbs: and hi song were a
thousand and five.

4:33 and he spake of trees, from the cedar tree that is in lebanon
even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall: he spake also of
beasts, and of fowl, and of creep things, and of fishes.

4:34 and there came of all peopl to hear the wisdom of solomon, from
al king of the earth, which had heard of hi wisdom.

5:1 and hiram king of tyre sent hi servant unto solomon; for he had
heard that they had anoint him king in the room of hi father: for
hiram wa ever a lover of david.

5:2 and solomon sent to hiram, saying, 5:3 thou knowest how that david
mi father could not build an hous unto the name of the lord hi god
for the war which were about him on everi side, until the lord put
them under the sole of hi feet.

5:4 but now the lord my god hath given me rest on everi side, so that
ther is neither adversari nor evil occurrent.

5:5 and, behold, I purpos to build an hous unto the name of the lord
mi god, as the lord spake unto david my father, saying, thi son, whom
i will set upon thi throne in thi room, he shall build an hous unto
mi name.

5:6 now therefor command thou that they hew me cedar tree out of
lebanon; and my servant shall be with thi servants: and unto thee
wil I give hire for thi servant accord to all that thou shalt
appoint: for thou knowest that there is not among us ani that can
skil to hew timber like unto the sidonians.

5:7 and it came to pass, when hiram heard the word of solomon, that
h rejoic greatly, and said, bless be the lord thi day, which
hath given unto david a wise son over thi great people.

5:8 and hiram sent to solomon, saying, I have consid the things
which thou sentest to me for: and I will do all thi desir concerning
timb of cedar, and concern timber of fir.

5:9 My servant shall bring them down from lebanon unto the sea: and i
wil convey them by sea in float unto the place that thou shalt
appoint me, and will caus them to be discharg there, and thou shalt
rec them: and thou shalt accomplish my desire, in give food for
mi household.

5:10 So hiram gave solomon cedar tree and fir tree accord to all
hi desire.

5:11 and solomon gave hiram twenti thousand measur of wheat for food
to hi household, and twenti measur of pure oil: thu gave solomon
to hiram year by year.

5:12 and the lord gave solomon wisdom, as he promis him: and there
wa peac between hiram and solomon; and they two made a league
together.

5:13 and king solomon rais a levi out of all israel; and the levy
wa thirti thousand men.

5:14 and he sent them to lebanon, ten thousand a month by courses: a
month they were in lebanon, and two month at home: and adoniram was
ov the levy.

5:15 and solomon had threescor and ten thousand that bare burdens,
and fourscor thousand hewer in the mountains; 5:16 besid the chief
of solomon' offic which were over the work, three thousand and
thre hundred, which rule over the peopl that wrought in the work.

5:17 and the king commanded, and they brought great stones, costly
stones, and hew stones, to lay the foundat of the house.

5:18 and solomon' builder and hiram' builder did hew them, and the
stonesquarers: so they prepar timber and stone to build the house.

6:1 and it came to pass in the four hundr and eightieth year after
th children of israel were come out of the land of egypt, in the
fourth year of solomon' reign over israel, in the month zif, which is
th second month, that he began to build the hous of the lord.

6:2 and the hous which king solomon built for the lord, the length
thereof wa threescor cubits, and the breadth thereof twenti cubits,
and the height thereof thirti cubits.

6:3 and the porch befor the templ of the house, twenti cubit was
th length thereof, accord to the breadth of the house; and ten
cubit wa the breadth thereof befor the house.

6:4 and for the hous he made window of narrow lights.

6:5 and against the wall of the hous he built chamber round about,
against the wall of the hous round about, both of the templ and of
th oracle: and he made chamber round about: 6:6 the nethermost
chamb wa five cubit broad, and the middl wa six cubit broad,
and the third wa seven cubit broad: for without in the wall of the
hous he made narrow rest round about, that the beam should not be
fasten in the wall of the house.

6:7 and the house, when it wa in building, wa built of stone made
readi befor it wa brought thither: so that there wa neither hammer
nor axe nor ani tool of iron heard in the house, while it wa in
building.

6:8 the door for the middl chamber wa in the right side of the
house: and they went up with wind stair into the middl chamber,
and out of the middl into the third.

6:9 So he built the house, and finish it; and cover the hous with
beam and board of cedar.

6:10 and then he built chamber against all the house, five cubits
high: and they rest on the hous with timber of cedar.

6:11 and the word of the lord came to solomon, saying, 6:12 concerning
thi hous which thou art in building, if thou wilt walk in my
statutes, and execut my judgments, and keep all my command to
walk in them; then will I perform my word with thee, which I spake
unto david thi father: 6:13 and I will dwell among the children of
israel, and will not forsak my peopl israel.

6:14 So solomon built the house, and finish it.

6:15 and he built the wall of the hous within with board of cedar,
both the floor of the house, and the wall of the ceiling: and he
cov them on the insid with wood, and cover the floor of the
hous with plank of fir.

6:16 and he built twenti cubit on the side of the house, both the
floor and the wall with board of cedar: he even built them for it
within, even for the oracle, even for the most holi place.

6:17 and the house, that is, the templ befor it, wa forti cubits
long.

6:18 and the cedar of the hous within wa carv with knop and open
flowers: all wa cedar; there wa no stone seen.

6:19 and the oracl he prepar in the hous within, to set there the
ark of the coven of the lord.

6:20 and the oracl in the forepart wa twenti cubit in length, and
twenti cubit in breadth, and twenti cubit in the height thereof: and
h overlaid it with pure gold; and so cover the altar which wa of
cedar.

6:21 So solomon overlaid the hous within with pure gold: and he made
a partit by the chain of gold befor the oracle; and he overlaid
it with gold.

6:22 and the whole hous he overlaid with gold, until he had finished
al the house: also the whole altar that wa by the oracl he overlaid
with gold.

6:23 and within the oracl he made two cherubim of oliv tree, each
ten cubit high.

6:24 and five cubit wa the one wing of the cherub, and five cubits
th other wing of the cherub: from the uttermost part of the one wing
unto the uttermost part of the other were ten cubits.

6:25 and the other cherub wa ten cubits: both the cherubim were of
on measur and one size.

6:26 the height of the one cherub wa ten cubits, and so wa it of the
oth cherub.

6:27 and he set the cherubim within the inner house: and they
stretch forth the wing of the cherubims, so that the wing of the
on touch the one wall, and the wing of the other cherub touch the
oth wall; and their wing touch one anoth in the midst of the
house.

6:28 and he overlaid the cherubim with gold.

6:29 and he carv all the wall of the hous round about with carved
figur of cherubim and palm tree and open flowers, within and
without.

6:30 and the floor of the hous he overlaid with gold, within and
without.

6:31 and for the enter of the oracl he made door of oliv tree:
th lintel and side post were a fifth part of the wall.

6:32 the two door also were of oliv tree; and he carv upon them
carv of cherubim and palm tree and open flowers, and overlaid
them with gold, and spread gold upon the cherubims, and upon the palm
trees.

6:33 So also made he for the door of the templ post of oliv tree, a
fourth part of the wall.

6:34 and the two door were of fir tree: the two leav of the one
door were folding, and the two leav of the other door were folding.

6:35 and he carv thereon cherubim and palm tree and open flowers:
and cover them with gold fit upon the carv work.

6:36 and he built the inner court with three row of hew stone, and
a row of cedar beams.

6:37 In the fourth year wa the foundat of the hous of the lord
laid, in the month zif: 6:38 and in the eleventh year, in the month
bul, which is the eighth month, wa the hous finish throughout all
th part thereof, and accord to all the fashion of it. So wa he
seven year in build it.

7:1 but solomon wa build hi own hous thirteen years, and he
finish all hi house.

7:2 He built also the hous of the forest of lebanon; the length
thereof wa an hundr cubits, and the breadth thereof fifti cubits,
and the height thereof thirti cubits, upon four row of cedar pillars,
with cedar beam upon the pillars.

7:3 and it wa cover with cedar abov upon the beams, that lay on
forti five pillars, fifteen in a row.

7:4 and there were window in three rows, and light wa against light
in three ranks.

7:5 and all the door and post were square, with the windows: and
light wa against light in three ranks.

7:6 and he made a porch of pillars; the length thereof wa fifty
cubits, and the breadth thereof thirti cubits: and the porch was
befor them: and the other pillar and the thick beam were before
them.

7:7 then he made a porch for the throne where he might judge, even the
porch of judgment: and it wa cover with cedar from one side of the
floor to the other.

7:8 and hi hous where he dwelt had anoth court within the porch,
which wa of the like work. solomon made also an hous for pharaoh's
daughter, whom he had taken to wife, like unto thi porch.

7:9 all these were of costli stones, accord to the measur of
hew stones, saw with saws, within and without, even from the
found unto the coping, and so on the outsid toward the great
court.

7:10 and the foundat wa of costli stones, even great stones,
ston of ten cubits, and stone of eight cubits.

7:11 and abov were costli stones, after the measur of hew stones,
and cedars.

7:12 and the great court round about wa with three row of hewed
stones, and a row of cedar beams, both for the inner court of the
hous of the lord, and for the porch of the house.

7:13 and king solomon sent and fetch hiram out of tyre.

7:14 He wa a widow' son of the tribe of naphtali, and hi father was
a man of tyre, a worker in brass: and he wa fill with wisdom, and
understanding, and cun to work all work in brass. and he came to
k solomon, and wrought all hi work.

7:15 for he cast two pillar of brass, of eighteen cubit high apiece:
and a line of twelv cubit did compass either of them about.

7:16 and he made two chapit of molten brass, to set upon the tops
of the pillars: the height of the one chapit wa five cubits, and
th height of the other chapit wa five cubits: 7:17 and net of
check work, and wreath of chain work, for the chapit which were
upon the top of the pillars; seven for the one chapiter, and seven for
th other chapiter.

7:18 and he made the pillars, and two row round about upon the one
network, to cover the chapit that were upon the top, with
pomegranates: and so did he for the other chapiter.

7:19 and the chapit that were upon the top of the pillar were of
lili work in the porch, four cubits.

7:20 and the chapit upon the two pillar had pomegran also
above, over against the belli which wa by the network: and the
pomegran were two hundr in row round about upon the other
chapiter.

7:21 and he set up the pillar in the porch of the temple: and he set
up the right pillar, and call the name thereof jachin: and he set up
th left pillar, and call the name thereof boaz.

7:22 and upon the top of the pillar wa lili work: so wa the work of
th pillar finished.

7:23 and he made a molten sea, ten cubit from the one brim to the
other: it wa round all about, and hi height wa five cubits: and a
lin of thirti cubit did compass it round about.

7:24 and under the brim of it round about there were knop compassing
it, ten in a cubit, compass the sea round about: the knop were
cast in two rows, when it wa cast.

7:25 It stood upon twelv oxen, three look toward the north, and
thre look toward the west, and three look toward the south, and
thre look toward the east: and the sea wa set abov upon them,
and all their hinder part were inward.

7:26 and it wa an hand breadth thick, and the brim thereof was
wrought like the brim of a cup, with flower of lilies: it contained
two thousand baths.

7:27 and he made ten base of brass; four cubit wa the length of one
base, and four cubit the breadth thereof, and three cubit the height
of it.

7:28 and the work of the base wa on thi manner: they had borders,
and the border were between the ledges: 7:29 and on the border that
wer between the ledg were lions, oxen, and cherubims: and upon the
ledg there wa a base above: and beneath the lion and oxen were
certain addit made of thin work.

7:30 and everi base had four brasen wheels, and plate of brass: and
th four corner thereof had undersetters: under the laver were
undersett molten, at the side of everi addition.

7:31 and the mouth of it within the chapit and abov wa a cubit:
but the mouth thereof wa round after the work of the base, a cubit
and an half: and also upon the mouth of it were grave with their
borders, foursquare, not round.

7:32 and under the border were four wheels; and the axletre of the
wheel were join to the base: and the height of a wheel wa a cubit
and half a cubit.

7:33 and the work of the wheel wa like the work of a chariot wheel:
their axletrees, and their naves, and their felloes, and their spokes,
wer all molten.

7:34 and there were four undersett to the four corner of one base:
and the undersett were of the veri base itself.

7:35 and in the top of the base wa there a round compass of half a
cubit high: and on the top of the base the ledg thereof and the
bord thereof were of the same.

7:36 for on the plate of the ledg thereof, and on the borders
thereof, he grave cherubims, lions, and palm trees, accord to the
proport of everi one, and addit round about.

7:37 after thi manner he made the ten bases: all of them had one
casting, one measure, and one size.

7:38 then made he ten laver of brass: one laver contain forty
baths: and everi laver wa four cubits: and upon everi one of the ten
bas one laver.

7:39 and he put five base on the right side of the house, and five on
th left side of the house: and he set the sea on the right side of
th hous eastward over against the south.

7:40 and hiram made the lavers, and the shovels, and the basons. so
hiram made an end of do all the work that he made king solomon for
th hous of the lord: 7:41 the two pillars, and the two bowl of the
chapit that were on the top of the two pillars; and the two
networks, to cover the two bowl of the chapit which were upon the
top of the pillars; 7:42 and four hundr pomegran for the two
networks, even two row of pomegran for one network, to cover the
two bowl of the chapit that were upon the pillars; 7:43 and the
ten bases, and ten laver on the bases; 7:44 and one sea, and twelve
oxen under the sea; 7:45 and the pots, and the shovels, and the
basons: and all these vessels, which hiram made to king solomon for
th hous of the lord, were of bright brass.

7:46 In the plain of jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground
between succoth and zarthan.

7:47 and solomon left all the vessel unweighed, becaus they were
exceed many: neither wa the weight of the brass found out.

7:48 and solomon made all the vessel that pertain unto the hous of
th lord: the altar of gold, and the tabl of gold, whereupon the
shewbread was, 7:49 and the candlestick of pure gold, five on the
right side, and five on the left, befor the oracle, with the flowers,
and the lamps, and the tong of gold, 7:50 and the bowls, and the
snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons, and the censer of pure
gold; and the hing of gold, both for the door of the inner house,
th most holi place, and for the door of the house, to wit, of the
temple.

7:51 So wa end all the work that king solomon made for the hous of
th lord. and solomon brought in the thing which david hi father had
dedicated; even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, did he put
among the treasur of the hous of the lord.

8:1 then solomon assembl the elder of israel, and all the head of
th tribes, the chief of the father of the children of israel, unto
k solomon in jerusalem, that they might bring up the ark of the
coven of the lord out of the citi of david, which is zion.

8:2 and all the men of israel assembl themselv unto king solomon
at the feast in the month ethanim, which is the seventh month.

8:3 and all the elder of israel came, and the priest took up the
ark.

8:4 and they brought up the ark of the lord, and the tabernacl of the
congregation, and all the holi vessel that were in the tabernacle,
even those did the priest and the levit bring up.

8:5 and king solomon, and all the congreg of israel, that were
assembl unto him, were with him befor the ark, sacrif sheep
and oxen, that could not be told nor number for multitude.

8:6 and the priest brought in the ark of the coven of the lord
unto hi place, into the oracl of the house, to the most holi place,
even under the wing of the cherubims.

8:7 for the cherubim spread forth their two wing over the place of
th ark, and the cherubim cover the ark and the stave thereof
above.

8:8 and they drew out the staves, that the end of the stave were
seen out in the holi place befor the oracle, and they were not seen
without: and there they are unto thi day.

8:9 there wa noth in the ark save the two tabl of stone, which
mos put there at horeb, when the lord made a coven with the
children of israel, when they came out of the land of egypt.

8:10 and it came to pass, when the priest were come out of the holy
place, that the cloud fill the hous of the lord, 8:11 So that the
priest could not stand to minist becaus of the cloud: for the
glori of the lord had fill the hous of the lord.

8:12 then spake solomon, the lord said that he would dwell in the
thick darkness.

8:13 I have sure built thee an hous to dwell in, a settl place
for thee to abid in for ever.

8:14 and the king turn hi face about, and bless all the
congreg of israel: (and all the congreg of israel stood;)
8:15 and he said, bless be the lord god of israel, which spake with
hi mouth unto david my father, and hath with hi hand fulfil it,
saying, 8:16 sinc the day that I brought forth my peopl israel out
of egypt, I chose no citi out of all the tribe of israel to build an
house, that my name might be therein; but I chose david to be over my
peopl israel.

8:17 and it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hous for
th name of the lord god of israel.

8:18 and the lord said unto david my father, wherea it wa in thine
heart to build an hous unto my name, thou didst well that it wa in
thin heart.

8:19 nevertheless thou shalt not build the house; but thi son that
shal come forth out of thi loins, he shall build the hous unto my
name.

8:20 and the lord hath perform hi word that he spake, and I am
risen up in the room of david my father, and sit on the throne of
israel, as the lord promised, and have built an hous for the name of
th lord god of israel.

8:21 and I have set there a place for the ark, wherein is the covenant
of the lord, which he made with our fathers, when he brought them out
of the land of egypt.

8:22 and solomon stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of
al the congreg of israel, and spread forth hi hand toward
heaven: 8:23 and he said, lord god of israel, there is no god like
thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath, who keepest coven and
merci with thi servant that walk befor thee with all their heart:
8:24 who hast kept with thi servant david my father that thou
promisedst him: thou spakest also with thi mouth, and hast fulfilled
it with thine hand, as it is thi day.

8:25 therefor now, lord god of israel, keep with thi servant david my
fath that thou promisedst him, saying, there shall not fail thee a
man in my sight to sit on the throne of israel; so that thi children
tak heed to their way, that they walk befor me as thou hast walked
befor me.

8:26 and now, O god of israel, let thi word, I pray thee, be verified,
which thou spakest unto thi servant david my father.

8:27 but will god inde dwell on the earth? behold, the heaven and
heaven of heaven cannot contain thee; how much less thi hous that i
hav builded?  8:28 yet have thou respect unto the prayer of thy
servant, and to hi supplication, O lord my god, to hearken unto the
cri and to the prayer, which thi servant prayeth befor thee to day:
8:29 that thine eye may be open toward thi hous night and day, even
toward the place of which thou hast said, My name shall be there: that
thou mayest hearken unto the prayer which thi servant shall make
toward thi place.

8:30 and hearken thou to the supplic of thi servant, and of thy
peopl israel, when they shall pray toward thi place: and hear thou
in heaven thi dwell place: and when thou hearest, forgive.

8:31 If ani man trespass against hi neighbour, and an oath be laid
upon him to caus him to swear, and the oath come befor thine altar
in thi house: 8:32 then hear thou in heaven, and do, and judg thy
servants, condemn the wicked, to bring hi way upon hi head; and
justifi the righteous, to give him accord to hi righteousness.

8:33 when thi peopl israel be smitten down befor the enemy, because
they have sin against thee, and shall turn again to thee, and
confess thi name, and pray, and make supplic unto thee in this
house: 8:34 then hear thou in heaven, and forgiv the sin of thy
peopl israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest
unto their fathers.

8:35 when heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, becaus they have
sin against thee; if they pray toward thi place, and confess thy
name, and turn from their sin, when thou afflictest them: 8:36 then
hear thou in heaven, and forgiv the sin of thi servants, and of thy
peopl israel, that thou teach them the good way wherein they should
walk, and give rain upon thi land, which thou hast given to thi people
for an inheritance.

8:37 If there be in the land famine, if there be pestilence, blasting,
mildew, locust, or if there be caterpiller; if their enemi besiege
them in the land of their cities; whatsoev plague, whatsoever
sick there be; 8:38 what prayer and supplic soever be made by
ani man, or by all thi peopl israel, which shall know everi man the
plagu of hi own heart, and spread forth hi hand toward thi house:
8:39 then hear thou in heaven thi dwell place, and forgive, and do,
and give to everi man accord to hi ways, whose heart thou knowest;
(for thou, even thou only, knowest the heart of all the children of
men;) 8:40 that they may fear thee all the day that they live in the
land which thou gavest unto our fathers.

8:41 moreov concern a stranger, that is not of thi peopl israel,
but cometh out of a far countri for thi name' sake; 8:42 (for they
shal hear of thi great name, and of thi strong hand, and of thy
stretch out arm;) when he shall come and pray toward thi house;
8:43 hear thou in heaven thi dwell place, and do accord to all
that the stranger calleth to thee for: that all peopl of the earth
may know thi name, to fear thee, as do thi peopl israel; and that
they may know that thi house, which I have builded, is call by thy
name.

8:44 If thi peopl go out to battl against their enemy, whithersoever
th shalt send them, and shall pray unto the lord toward the city
which thou hast chosen, and toward the hous that I have built for thy
name: 8:45 then hear thou in heaven their prayer and their
supplication, and maintain their cause.

8:46 If they sin against thee, (for there is no man that sinneth not,)
and thou be angri with them, and deliv them to the enemy, so that
they carri them away captiv unto the land of the enemy, far or near;
8:47 yet if they shall bethink themselv in the land whither they
wer carri captives, and repent, and make supplic unto thee in
th land of them that carri them captives, saying, We have sinned,
and have done perversely, we have commit wickedness; 8:48 and so
return unto thee with all their heart, and with all their soul, in the
land of their enemies, which led them away captive, and pray unto thee
toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, the city
which thou hast chosen, and the hous which I have built for thi name:
8:49 then hear thou their prayer and their supplic in heaven thy
dwel place, and maintain their cause, 8:50 and forgiv thi people
that have sin against thee, and all their transgress wherein
they have transgress against thee, and give them compass before
them who carri them captive, that they may have compass on them:
8:51 for they be thi people, and thine inheritance, which thou
broughtest forth out of egypt, from the midst of the furnac of iron:
8:52 that thine eye may be open unto the supplic of thi servant,
and unto the supplic of thi peopl israel, to hearken unto them
in all that they call for unto thee.

8:53 for thou didst separ them from among all the peopl of the
earth, to be thine inheritance, as thou spakest by the hand of moses
thi servant, when thou broughtest our father out of egypt, O lord
god.

8:54 and it wa so, that when solomon had made an end of pray all
thi prayer and supplic unto the lord, he aros from befor the
altar of the lord, from kneel on hi knee with hi hand spread up
to heaven.

8:55 and he stood, and bless all the congreg of israel with a
loud voice, saying, 8:56 bless be the lord, that hath given rest
unto hi peopl israel, accord to all that he promised: there hath
not fail one word of all hi good promise, which he promis by the
hand of mose hi servant.

8:57 the lord our god be with us, as he wa with our fathers: let him
not leav us, nor forsak us: 8:58 that he may inclin our heart unto
him, to walk in all hi ways, and to keep hi commandments, and his
statutes, and hi judgments, which he command our fathers.

8:59 and let these my words, wherewith I have made supplic before
th lord, be nigh unto the lord our god day and night, that he
maintain the caus of hi servant, and the caus of hi peopl israel
at all times, as the matter shall require: 8:60 that all the peopl of
th earth may know that the lord is god, and that there is none else.

8:61 let your heart therefor be perfect with the lord our god, to
walk in hi statutes, and to keep hi commandments, as at thi day.

8:62 and the king, and all israel with him, offer sacrific before
th lord.

8:63 and solomon offer a sacrific of peac offerings, which he
off unto the lord, two and twenti thousand oxen, and an hundred
and twenti thousand sheep. So the king and all the children of israel
ded the hous of the lord.

8:64 the same day did the king hallow the middl of the court that was
befor the hous of the lord: for there he offer burnt offerings,
and meat offerings, and the fat of the peac offerings: becaus the
brasen altar that wa befor the lord wa too littl to receiv the
burnt offerings, and meat offerings, and the fat of the peace
offerings.

8:65 and at that time solomon held a feast, and all israel with him, a
great congregation, from the enter in of hamath unto the river of
egypt, befor the lord our god, seven day and seven days, even
fourteen days.

8:66 On the eighth day he sent the peopl away: and they bless the
king, and went unto their tent joy and glad of heart for all the
good that the lord had done for david hi servant, and for israel
hi people.

9:1 and it came to pass, when solomon had finish the build of the
hous of the lord, and the king' house, and all solomon' desire
which he wa pleas to do, 9:2 that the lord appear to solomon the
second time, as he had appear unto him at gibeon.

9:3 and the lord said unto him, I have heard thi prayer and thy
supplication, that thou hast made befor me: I have hallow this
house, which thou hast built, to put my name there for ever; and mine
ey and mine heart shall be there perpetually.

9:4 and if thou wilt walk befor me, as david thi father walked, in
integr of heart, and in uprightness, to do accord to all that i
hav command thee, and wilt keep my statut and my judgments: 9:5
then I will establish the throne of thi kingdom upon israel for ever,
a I promis to david thi father, saying, there shall not fail thee a
man upon the throne of israel.

9:6 but if ye shall at all turn from follow me, ye or your
children, and will not keep my command and my statut which i
hav set befor you, but go and serv other gods, and worship them:
9:7 then will I cut off israel out of the land which I have given
them; and thi house, which I have hallow for my name, will I cast
out of my sight; and israel shall be a proverb and a byword among all
people: 9:8 and at thi house, which is high, everi one that passeth
bi it shall be astonished, and shall hiss; and they shall say, why
hath the lord done thu unto thi land, and to thi house?  9:9 and
they shall answer, becaus they forsook the lord their god, who
brought forth their father out of the land of egypt, and have taken
hold upon other gods, and have worship them, and serv them:
therefor hath the lord brought upon them all thi evil.

9:10 and it came to pass at the end of twenti years, when solomon had
built the two houses, the hous of the lord, and the king' house,
9:11 (now hiram the king of tyre had furnish solomon with cedar
tre and fir trees, and with gold, accord to all hi desire,) that
then king solomon gave hiram twenti citi in the land of galilee.

9:12 and hiram came out from tyre to see the citi which solomon had
given him; and they pleas him not.

9:13 and he said, what citi are these which thou hast given me, my
brother? and he call them the land of cabul unto thi day.

9:14 and hiram sent to the king sixscor talent of gold.

9:15 and thi is the reason of the levi which king solomon raised; for
to build the hous of the lord, and hi own house, and millo, and the
wal of jerusalem, and hazor, and megiddo, and gezer.

9:16 for pharaoh king of egypt had gone up, and taken gezer, and burnt
it with fire, and slain the canaanit that dwelt in the city, and
given it for a present unto hi daughter, solomon' wife.

9:17 and solomon built gezer, and bethhoron the nether, 9:18 and
baalath, and tadmor in the wilderness, in the land, 9:19 and all the
citi of store that solomon had, and citi for hi chariots, and
citi for hi horsemen, and that which solomon desir to build in
jerusalem, and in lebanon, and in all the land of hi dominion.

9:20 and all the peopl that were left of the amorites, hittites,
perizzites, hivites, and jebusites, which were not of the children of
israel, 9:21 their children that were left after them in the land,
whom the children of israel also were not abl utterli to destroy,
upon those did solomon levi a tribut of bondservic unto thi day.

9:22 but of the children of israel did solomon make no bondmen: but
they were men of war, and hi servants, and hi princes, and his
captains, and ruler of hi chariots, and hi horsemen.

9:23 these were the chief of the offic that were over solomon's
work, five hundr and fifty, which bare rule over the peopl that
wrought in the work.

9:24 but pharaoh' daughter came up out of the citi of david unto her
hous which solomon had built for her: then did he build millo.

9:25 and three time in a year did solomon offer burnt offer and
peac offer upon the altar which he built unto the lord, and he
burnt incens upon the altar that wa befor the lord. So he finished
th house.

9:26 and king solomon made a navi of ship in eziongeber, which is
besid eloth, on the shore of the red sea, in the land of edom.

9:27 and hiram sent in the navi hi servants, shipmen that had
knowledg of the sea, with the servant of solomon.

9:28 and they came to ophir, and fetch from thenc gold, four
hundr and twenti talents, and brought it to king solomon.

10:1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon
concern the name of the lord, she came to prove him with hard
questions.

10:2 and she came to jerusalem with a veri great train, with camels
that bare spices, and veri much gold, and preciou stones: and when
sh wa come to solomon, she commun with him of all that wa in her
heart.

10:3 and solomon told her all her questions: there wa not ani thing
hid from the king, which he told her not.

10:4 and when the queen of sheba had seen all solomon' wisdom, and
th hous that he had built, 10:5 and the meat of hi table, and the
sit of hi servants, and the attend of hi ministers, and
their apparel, and hi cupbearers, and hi ascent by which he went up
unto the hous of the lord; there wa no more spirit in her.

10:6 and she said to the king, It wa a true report that I heard in
min own land of thi act and of thi wisdom.

10:7 howbeit I believ not the words, until I came, and mine eye had
seen it: and, behold, the half wa not told me: thi wisdom and
prosper exceedeth the fame which I heard.

10:8 happi are thi men, happi are these thi servants, which stand
continu befor thee, and that hear thi wisdom.

10:9 bless be the lord thi god, which delight in thee, to set thee
on the throne of israel: becaus the lord love israel for ever,
therefor made he thee king, to do judgment and justice.

10:10 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold, and
of spice veri great store, and preciou stones: there came no more
such abund of spice as these which the queen of sheba gave to
k solomon.

10:11 and the navi also of hiram, that brought gold from ophir,
brought in from ophir great plenti of almug trees, and precious
stones.

10:12 and the king made of the almug tree pillar for the hous of
th lord, and for the king' house, harp also and psalteri for
singers: there came no such almug trees, nor were seen unto thi day.

10:13 and king solomon gave unto the queen of sheba all her desire,
whatsoev she asked, besid that which solomon gave her of hi royal
bounty.

so she turn and went to her own country, she and her servants.

10:14 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six
hundr threescor and six talent of gold, 10:15 besid that he had
of the merchantmen, and of the traffick of the spice merchants, and of
al the king of arabia, and of the governor of the country.

10:16 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold: six
hundr shekel of gold went to one target.

10:17 and he made three hundr shield of beaten gold; three pound of
gold went to one shield: and the king put them in the hous of the
forest of lebanon.

10:18 moreov the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it
with the best gold.

10:19 the throne had six steps, and the top of the throne wa round
behind: and there were stay on either side on the place of the seat,
and two lion stood besid the stays.

10:20 and twelv lion stood there on the one side and on the other
upon the six steps: there wa not the like made in ani kingdom.

10:21 and all king solomon' drink vessel were of gold, and all
th vessel of the hous of the forest of lebanon were of pure gold;
non were of silver: it wa noth account of in the day of
solomon.

10:22 for the king had at sea a navi of tharshish with the navi of
hiram: onc in three year came the navi of tharshish, bring gold,
and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

10:23 So king solomon exceed all the king of the earth for riches
and for wisdom.

10:24 and all the earth sought to solomon, to hear hi wisdom, which
god had put in hi heart.

10:25 and they brought everi man hi present, vessel of silver, and
vessel of gold, and garments, and armour, and spices, horses, and
mules, a rate year by year.

10:26 and solomon gather togeth chariot and horsemen: and he had
a thousand and four hundr chariots, and twelv thousand horsemen,
whom he bestow in the citi for chariots, and with the king at
jerusalem.

10:27 and the king made silver to be in jerusalem as stones, and
cedar made he to be as the sycomor tree that are in the vale, for
abundance.

10:28 and solomon had hors brought out of egypt, and linen yarn: the
king' merchant receiv the linen yarn at a price.

10:29 and a chariot came up and went out of egypt for six hundred
shekel of silver, and an hors for an hundr and fifty: and so for
al the king of the hittites, and for the king of syria, did they
br them out by their means.

11:1 but king solomon love mani strang women, togeth with the
daught of pharaoh, women of the moabites, ammonites, edomites,
zidonians, and hittites: 11:2 Of the nation concern which the lord
said unto the children of israel, Ye shall not go in to them, neither
shal they come in unto you: for sure they will turn away your heart
aft their gods: solomon clave unto these in love.

11:3 and he had seven hundr wives, princesses, and three hundred
concubines: and hi wive turn away hi heart.

11:4 for it came to pass, when solomon wa old, that hi wive turned
away hi heart after other gods: and hi heart wa not perfect with
th lord hi god, as wa the heart of david hi father.

11:5 for solomon went after ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonians,
and after milcom the abomin of the ammonites.

11:6 and solomon did evil in the sight of the lord, and went not fully
aft the lord, as did david hi father.

11:7 then did solomon build an high place for chemosh, the abomination
of moab, in the hill that is befor jerusalem, and for molech, the
abomin of the children of ammon.

11:8 and likewis did he for all hi strang wives, which burnt
incens and sacrif unto their gods.

11:9 and the lord wa angri with solomon, becaus hi heart wa turned
from the lord god of israel, which had appear unto him twice, 11:10
and had command him concern thi thing, that he should not go
aft other gods: but he kept not that which the lord commanded.

11:11 wherefor the lord said unto solomon, forasmuch as thi is done
of thee, and thou hast not kept my coven and my statutes, which i
hav command thee, I will sure rend the kingdom from thee, and
wil give it to thi servant.

11:12 notwithstand in thi day I will not do it for david thy
father' sake: but I will rend it out of the hand of thi son.

11:13 howbeit I will not rend away all the kingdom; but will give one
trib to thi son for david my servant' sake, and for jerusalem' sake
which I have chosen.

11:14 and the lord stir up an adversari unto solomon, hadad the
edomite: he wa of the king' seed in edom.

11:15 for it came to pass, when david wa in edom, and joab the
captain of the host wa gone up to buri the slain, after he had
smitten everi male in edom; 11:16 (for six month did joab remain
ther with all israel, until he had cut off everi male in edom:) 11:17
that hadad fled, he and certain edomit of hi father' servant with
him, to go into egypt; hadad be yet a littl child.

11:18 and they aros out of midian, and came to paran: and they took
men with them out of paran, and they came to egypt, unto pharaoh king
of egypt; which gave him an house, and appoint him victuals, and
gav him land.

11:19 and hadad found great favour in the sight of pharaoh, so that he
gav him to wife the sister of hi own wife, the sister of tahpenes
th queen.

11:20 and the sister of tahpen bare him genubath hi son, whom
tahpen wean in pharaoh' house: and genubath wa in pharaoh's
household among the son of pharaoh.

11:21 and when hadad heard in egypt that david slept with hi fathers,
and that joab the captain of the host wa dead, hadad said to pharaoh,
let me depart, that I may go to mine own country.

11:22 then pharaoh said unto him, but what hast thou lack with me,
that, behold, thou seekest to go to thine own country? and he
answered, nothing: howbeit let me go in ani wise.

11:23 and god stir him up anoth adversary, rezon the son of
eliadah, which fled from hi lord hadadez king of zobah: 11:24 and
h gather men unto him, and becam captain over a band, when david
slew them of zobah: and they went to damascus, and dwelt therein, and
reign in damascus.

11:25 and he wa an adversari to israel all the day of solomon,
besid the mischief that hadad did: and he abhor israel, and
reign over syria.

11:26 and jeroboam the son of nebat, an ephrathit of zereda,
solomon' servant, whose mother' name wa zeruah, a widow woman, even
h lift up hi hand against the king.

11:27 and thi wa the caus that he lift up hi hand against the
king: solomon built millo, and repair the breach of the citi of
david hi father.

11:28 and the man jeroboam wa a mighti man of valour: and solomon
se the young man that he wa industrious, he made him ruler over
al the charg of the hous of joseph.

11:29 and it came to pass at that time when jeroboam went out of
jerusalem, that the prophet ahijah the shilonit found him in the way;
and he had clad himself with a new garment; and they two were alon in
th field: 11:30 and ahijah caught the new garment that wa on him,
and rent it in twelv pieces: 11:31 and he said to jeroboam, take thee
ten pieces: for thu saith the lord, the god of israel, behold, I will
rend the kingdom out of the hand of solomon, and will give ten tribes
to thee: 11:32 (but he shall have one tribe for my servant david's
sake, and for jerusalem' sake, the citi which I have chosen out of
al the tribe of israel:) 11:33 becaus that they have forsaken me,
and have worship ashtoreth the goddess of the zidonians, chemosh
th god of the moabites, and milcom the god of the children of ammon,
and have not walk in my ways, to do that which is right in mine
eyes, and to keep my statut and my judgments, as did david his
father.

11:34 howbeit I will not take the whole kingdom out of hi hand: but i
wil make him princ all the day of hi life for david my servant's
sake, whom I chose, becaus he kept my command and my statutes:
11:35 but I will take the kingdom out of hi son' hand, and will give
it unto thee, even ten tribes.

11:36 and unto hi son will I give one tribe, that david my servant
may have a light alway befor me in jerusalem, the citi which I have
chosen me to put my name there.

11:37 and I will take thee, and thou shalt reign accord to all that
thi soul desireth, and shalt be king over israel.

11:38 and it shall be, if thou wilt hearken unto all that I command
thee, and wilt walk in my ways, and do that is right in my sight, to
keep my statut and my commandments, as david my servant did; that i
wil be with thee, and build thee a sure house, as I built for david,
and will give israel unto thee.

11:39 and I will for thi afflict the seed of david, but not for ever.

11:40 solomon sought therefor to kill jeroboam. and jeroboam arose,
and fled into egypt, unto shishak king of egypt, and wa in egypt
until the death of solomon.

11:41 and the rest of the act of solomon, and all that he did, and
hi wisdom, are they not written in the book of the act of solomon?
11:42 and the time that solomon reign in jerusalem over all israel
wa forti years.

11:43 and solomon slept with hi fathers, and wa buri in the city
of david hi father: and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead.

12:1 and rehoboam went to shechem: for all israel were come to shechem
to make him king.

12:2 and it came to pass, when jeroboam the son of nebat, who wa yet
in egypt, heard of it, (for he wa fled from the presenc of king
solomon, and jeroboam dwelt in egypt;) 12:3 that they sent and called
him. and jeroboam and all the congreg of israel came, and spake
unto rehoboam, saying, 12:4 thi father made our yoke grievous: now
therefor make thou the grievou servic of thi father, and hi heavy
yok which he put upon us, lighter, and we will serv thee.

12:5 and he said unto them, depart yet for three days, then come again
to me. and the peopl departed.

12:6 and king rehoboam consult with the old men, that stood before
solomon hi father while he yet lived, and said, how do ye advis that
i may answer thi people?  12:7 and they spake unto him, saying, if
thou wilt be a servant unto thi peopl thi day, and wilt serv them,
and answer them, and speak good word to them, then they will be thy
serv for ever.

12:8 but he forsook the counsel of the old men, which they had given
him, and consult with the young men that were grown up with him, and
which stood befor him: 12:9 and he said unto them, what counsel give
y that we may answer thi people, who have spoken to me, saying, make
th yoke which thi father did put upon us lighter?  12:10 and the
young men that were grown up with him spake unto him, saying, thus
shalt thou speak unto thi peopl that spake unto thee, saying, thy
fath made our yoke heavy, but make thou it lighter unto us; thus
shalt thou say unto them, My littl finger shall be thicker than my
father' loins.

12:11 and now wherea my father did lade you with a heavi yoke, I will
add to your yoke: my father hath chastis you with whips, but I will
chastis you with scorpions.

12:12 So jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam the third day,
a the king had appointed, saying, come to me again the third day.

12:13 and the king answer the peopl roughly, and forsook the old
men' counsel that they gave him; 12:14 and spake to them after the
counsel of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, and
i will add to your yoke: my father also chastis you with whips, but
i will chastis you with scorpions.

12:15 wherefor the king hearken not unto the people; for the cause
wa from the lord, that he might perform hi saying, which the lord
spak by ahijah the shilonit unto jeroboam the son of nebat.

12:16 So when all israel saw that the king hearken not unto them,
th peopl answer the king, saying, what portion have we in david?
neith have we inherit in the son of jesse: to your tents, o
israel: now see to thine own house, david. So israel depart unto
their tents.

12:17 but as for the children of israel which dwelt in the citi of
judah, rehoboam reign over them.

12:18 then king rehoboam sent adoram, who wa over the tribute; and
al israel stone him with stones, that he died. therefor king
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot, to flee to
jerusalem.

12:19 So israel rebel against the hous of david unto thi day.

12:20 and it came to pass, when all israel heard that jeroboam was
com again, that they sent and call him unto the congregation, and
mad him king over all israel: there wa none that follow the house
of david, but the tribe of judah only.

12:21 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem, he assembl all the
hous of judah, with the tribe of benjamin, an hundr and fourscore
thousand chosen men, which were warriors, to fight against the house
of israel, to bring the kingdom again to rehoboam the son of solomon.

12:22 but the word of god came unto shemaiah the man of god, saying,
12:23 speak unto rehoboam, the son of solomon, king of judah, and unto
al the hous of judah and benjamin, and to the remnant of the people,
saying, 12:24 thu saith the lord, Ye shall not go up, nor fight
against your brethren the children of israel: return everi man to his
house; for thi thing is from me. they hearken therefor to the word
of the lord, and return to depart, accord to the word of the
lord.

12:25 then jeroboam built shechem in mount ephraim, and dwelt therein;
and went out from thence, and built penuel.

12:26 and jeroboam said in hi heart, now shall the kingdom return to
th hous of david: 12:27 If thi peopl go up to do sacrific in the
hous of the lord at jerusalem, then shall the heart of thi people
turn again unto their lord, even unto rehoboam king of judah, and they
shal kill me, and go again to rehoboam king of judah.

12:28 whereupon the king took counsel, and made two calv of gold,
and said unto them, It is too much for you to go up to jerusalem:
behold thi gods, O israel, which brought thee up out of the land of
egypt.

12:29 and he set the one in bethel, and the other put he in dan.

12:30 and thi thing becam a sin: for the peopl went to worship
befor the one, even unto dan.

12:31 and he made an hous of high places, and made priest of the
lowest of the people, which were not of the son of levi.

12:32 and jeroboam ordain a feast in the eighth month, on the
fifteenth day of the month, like unto the feast that is in judah, and
h offer upon the altar. So did he in bethel, sacrif unto the
calv that he had made: and he place in bethel the priest of the
high place which he had made.

12:33 So he offer upon the altar which he had made in bethel the
fifteenth day of the eighth month, even in the month which he had
devis of hi own heart; and ordain a feast unto the children of
israel: and he offer upon the altar, and burnt incense.

13:1 and, behold, there came a man of god out of judah by the word of
th lord unto bethel: and jeroboam stood by the altar to burn incense.

13:2 and he cri against the altar in the word of the lord, and said,
o altar, altar, thu saith the lord; behold, a child shall be born
unto the hous of david, josiah by name; and upon thee shall he offer
th priest of the high place that burn incens upon thee, and men's
bon shall be burnt upon thee.

13:3 and he gave a sign the same day, saying, thi is the sign which
th lord hath spoken; behold, the altar shall be rent, and the ashes
that are upon it shall be pour out.

13:4 and it came to pass, when king jeroboam heard the say of the
man of god, which had cri against the altar in bethel, that he put
forth hi hand from the altar, saying, lay hold on him. and hi hand,
which he put forth against him, dri up, so that he could not pull it
in again to him.

13:5 the altar also wa rent, and the ash pour out from the altar,
accord to the sign which the man of god had given by the word of
th lord.

13:6 and the king answer and said unto the man of god, intreat now
th face of the lord thi god, and pray for me, that my hand may be
restor me again. and the man of god besought the lord, and the
king' hand wa restor him again, and becam as it wa before.

13:7 and the king said unto the man of god, come home with me, and
refresh thyself, and I will give thee a reward.

13:8 and the man of god said unto the king, If thou wilt give me half
thin house, I will not go in with thee, neither will I eat bread nor
drink water in thi place: 13:9 for so wa it charg me by the word
of the lord, saying, eat no bread, nor drink water, nor turn again by
th same way that thou camest.

13:10 So he went anoth way, and return not by the way that he came
to bethel.

13:11 now there dwelt an old prophet in bethel; and hi son came and
told him all the work that the man of god had done that day in
bethel: the word which he had spoken unto the king, them they told
also to their father.

13:12 and their father said unto them, what way went he? for hi sons
had seen what way the man of god went, which came from judah.

13:13 and he said unto hi sons, saddl me the ass. So they saddled
him the ass: and he rode thereon, 13:14 and went after the man of god,
and found him sit under an oak: and he said unto him, art thou the
man of god that camest from judah? and he said, I am.

13:15 then he said unto him, come home with me, and eat bread.

13:16 and he said, I may not return with thee, nor go in with thee:
neith will I eat bread nor drink water with thee in thi place:
13:17 for it wa said to me by the word of the lord, thou shalt eat no
bread nor drink water there, nor turn again to go by the way that thou
camest.

13:18 He said unto him, I am a prophet also as thou art; and an angel
spak unto me by the word of the lord, saying, bring him back with
the into thine house, that he may eat bread and drink water. but he
li unto him.

13:19 So he went back with him, and did eat bread in hi house, and
drank water.

13:20 and it came to pass, as they sat at the table, that the word of
th lord came unto the prophet that brought him back: 13:21 and he
cri unto the man of god that came from judah, saying, thu saith the
lord, forasmuch as thou hast disobey the mouth of the lord, and hast
not kept the command which the lord thi god command thee, 13:22
but camest back, and hast eaten bread and drunk water in the place, of
th which the lord did say to thee, eat no bread, and drink no water;
thi carcas shall not come unto the sepulchr of thi fathers.

13:23 and it came to pass, after he had eaten bread, and after he had
drunk, that he saddl for him the ass, to wit, for the prophet whom
h had brought back.

13:24 and when he wa gone, a lion met him by the way, and slew him:
and hi carcas wa cast in the way, and the ass stood by it, the lion
also stood by the carcase.

13:25 and, behold, men pass by, and saw the carcas cast in the way,
and the lion stand by the carcase: and they came and told it in the
citi where the old prophet dwelt.

13:26 and when the prophet that brought him back from the way heard
thereof, he said, It is the man of god, who wa disobedi unto the
word of the lord: therefor the lord hath deliv him unto the lion,
which hath torn him, and slain him, accord to the word of the lord,
which he spake unto him.

13:27 and he spake to hi sons, saying, saddl me the ass. and they
saddl him.

13:28 and he went and found hi carcas cast in the way, and the ass
and the lion stand by the carcase: the lion had not eaten the
carcase, nor torn the ass.

13:29 and the prophet took up the carcas of the man of god, and laid
it upon the ass, and brought it back: and the old prophet came to the
city, to mourn and to buri him.

13:30 and he laid hi carcas in hi own grave; and they mourn over
him, saying, alas, my brother!  13:31 and it came to pass, after he
had buri him, that he spake to hi sons, saying, when I am dead,
then buri me in the sepulchr wherein the man of god is buried; lay my
bon besid hi bones: 13:32 for the say which he cri by the
word of the lord against the altar in bethel, and against all the
hous of the high place which are in the citi of samaria, shall
sur come to pass.

13:33 after thi thing jeroboam return not from hi evil way, but
mad again of the lowest of the peopl priest of the high places:
whosoev would, he consecr him, and he becam one of the priests
of the high places.

13:34 and thi thing becam sin unto the hous of jeroboam, even to
cut it off, and to destroy it from off the face of the earth.

14:1 At that time abijah the son of jeroboam fell sick.

14:2 and jeroboam said to hi wife, arise, I pray thee, and disguise
thyself, that thou be not known to be the wife of jeroboam; and get
the to shiloh: behold, there is ahijah the prophet, which told me
that I should be king over thi people.

14:3 and take with thee ten loaves, and cracknels, and a cruse of
honey, and go to him: he shall tell thee what shall becom of the
child.

14:4 and jeroboam' wife did so, and arose, and went to shiloh, and
cam to the hous of ahijah. but ahijah could not see; for hi eyes
wer set by reason of hi age.

14:5 and the lord said unto ahijah, behold, the wife of jeroboam
cometh to ask a thing of thee for her son; for he is sick: thu and
thu shalt thou say unto her: for it shall be, when she cometh in,
that she shall feign herself to be anoth woman.

14:6 and it wa so, when ahijah heard the sound of her feet, as she
cam in at the door, that he said, come in, thou wife of jeroboam; why
feignest thou thyself to be another? for I am sent to thee with heavy
tidings.

14:7 go, tell jeroboam, thu saith the lord god of israel, forasmuch
a I exalt thee from among the people, and made thee princ over my
peopl israel, 14:8 and rent the kingdom away from the hous of david,
and gave it thee: and yet thou hast not been as my servant david, who
kept my commandments, and who follow me with all hi heart, to do
that onli which wa right in mine eyes; 14:9 but hast done evil above
al that were befor thee: for thou hast gone and made thee other
gods, and molten images, to provok me to anger, and hast cast me
behind thi back: 14:10 therefore, behold, I will bring evil upon the
hous of jeroboam, and will cut off from jeroboam him that pisseth
against the wall, and him that is shut up and left in israel, and will
tak away the remnant of the hous of jeroboam, as a man taketh away
dung, till it be all gone.

14:11 him that dieth of jeroboam in the citi shall the dog eat; and
him that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat: for the
lord hath spoken it.

14:12 aris thou therefore, get thee to thine own house: and when thy
feet enter into the city, the child shall die.

14:13 and all israel shall mourn for him, and buri him: for he onli of
jeroboam shall come to the grave, becaus in him there is found some
good thing toward the lord god of israel in the hous of jeroboam.

14:14 moreov the lord shall rais him up a king over israel, who
shal cut off the hous of jeroboam that day: but what? even now.

14:15 for the lord shall smite israel, as a reed is shaken in the
water, and he shall root up israel out of thi good land, which he
gav to their fathers, and shall scatter them beyond the river,
becaus they have made their groves, provok the lord to anger.

14:16 and he shall give israel up becaus of the sin of jeroboam, who
did sin, and who made israel to sin.

14:17 and jeroboam' wife arose, and departed, and came to tirzah: and
when she came to the threshold of the door, the child died; 14:18 and
they buri him; and all israel mourn for him, accord to the word
of the lord, which he spake by the hand of hi servant ahijah the
prophet.

14:19 and the rest of the act of jeroboam, how he warred, and how he
reigned, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicl of the
k of israel.

14:20 and the day which jeroboam reign were two and twenti years:
and he slept with hi fathers, and nadab hi son reign in hi stead.

14:21 and rehoboam the son of solomon reign in judah. rehoboam was
forti and one year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
seventeen year in jerusalem, the citi which the lord did choos out
of all the tribe of israel, to put hi name there. and hi mother's
nam wa naamah an ammonitess.

14:22 and judah did evil in the sight of the lord, and they provoked
him to jealousi with their sin which they had committed, abov all
that their father had done.

14:23 for they also built them high places, and images, and groves, on
everi high hill, and under everi green tree.

14:24 and there were also sodomit in the land: and they did
accord to all the abomin of the nation which the lord cast
out befor the children of israel.

14:25 and it came to pass in the fifth year of king rehoboam, that
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem: 14:26 and he took
away the treasur of the hous of the lord, and the treasur of the
king' house; he even took away all: and he took away all the shields
of gold which solomon had made.

14:27 and king rehoboam made in their stead brasen shields, and
commit them unto the hand of the chief of the guard, which kept
th door of the king' house.

14:28 and it wa so, when the king went into the hous of the lord,
that the guard bare them, and brought them back into the guard
chamber.

14:29 now the rest of the act of rehoboam, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
14:30 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all their days.
