14:31 and rehoboam slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with his
fath in the citi of david. and hi mother' name wa naamah an
ammonitess. and abijam hi son reign in hi stead.

15:1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam the son of nebat
reign abijam over judah.

15:2 three year reign he in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
maachah, the daughter of abishalom.

15:3 and he walk in all the sin of hi father, which he had done
befor him: and hi heart wa not perfect with the lord hi god, as
th heart of david hi father.

15:4 nevertheless for david' sake did the lord hi god give him a
lamp in jerusalem, to set up hi son after him, and to establish
jerusalem: 15:5 becaus david did that which wa right in the eye of
th lord, and turn not asid from ani thing that he command him
al the day of hi life, save onli in the matter of uriah the
hittite.

15:6 and there wa war between rehoboam and jeroboam all the day of
hi life.

15:7 now the rest of the act of abijam, and all that he did, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah? and
ther wa war between abijam and jeroboam.

15:8 and abijam slept with hi fathers; and they buri him in the
citi of david: and asa hi son reign in hi stead.

15:9 and in the twentieth year of jeroboam king of israel reign asa
ov judah.

15:10 and forti and one year reign he in jerusalem. and his
mother' name wa maachah, the daughter of abishalom.

15:11 and asa did that which wa right in the eye of the lord, as did
david hi father.

15:12 and he took away the sodomit out of the land, and remov all
th idol that hi father had made.

15:13 and also maachah hi mother, even her he remov from being
queen, becaus she had made an idol in a grove; and asa destroy her
idol, and burnt it by the brook kidron.

15:14 but the high place were not removed: nevertheless asa' heart
wa perfect with the lord all hi days.

15:15 and he brought in the thing which hi father had dedicated, and
th thing which himself had dedicated, into the hous of the lord,
silver, and gold, and vessels.

15:16 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all
their days.

15:17 and baasha king of israel went up against judah, and built
ramah, that he might not suffer ani to go out or come in to asa king
of judah.

15:18 then asa took all the silver and the gold that were left in the
treasur of the hous of the lord, and the treasur of the king's
house, and deliv them into the hand of hi servants: and king asa
s them to benhadad, the son of tabrimon, the son of hezion, king of
syria, that dwelt at damascus, saying, 15:19 there is a leagu between
m and thee, and between my father and thi father: behold, I have sent
unto thee a present of silver and gold; come and break thi leagu with
baasha king of israel, that he may depart from me.

15:20 So benhadad hearken unto king asa, and sent the captain of
th host which he had against the citi of israel, and smote ijon,
and dan, and abelbethmaachah, and all cinneroth, with all the land of
naphtali.

15:21 and it came to pass, when baasha heard thereof, that he left off
build of ramah, and dwelt in tirzah.

15:22 then king asa made a proclam throughout all judah; none was
exempted: and they took away the stone of ramah, and the timber
thereof, wherewith baasha had builded; and king asa built with them
geba of benjamin, and mizpah.

15:23 the rest of all the act of asa, and all hi might, and all that
h did, and the citi which he built, are they not written in the
book of the chronicl of the king of judah? nevertheless in the time
of hi old age he wa diseas in hi feet.

15:24 and asa slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with hi fathers
in the citi of david hi father: and jehoshaphat hi son reign in
hi stead.

15:25 and nadab the son of jeroboam began to reign over israel in the
second year of asa king of judah, and reign over israel two years.

15:26 and he did evil in the sight of the lord, and walk in the way
of hi father, and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin.

15:27 and baasha the son of ahijah, of the hous of issachar,
conspir against him; and baasha smote him at gibbethon, which
belong to the philistines; for nadab and all israel laid sieg to
gibbethon.

15:28 even in the third year of asa king of judah did baasha slay him,
and reign in hi stead.

15:29 and it came to pass, when he reigned, that he smote all the
hous of jeroboam; he left not to jeroboam ani that breathed, until he
had destroy him, accord unto the say of the lord, which he
spak by hi servant ahijah the shilonite: 15:30 becaus of the sins
of jeroboam which he sinned, and which he made israel sin, by his
provoc wherewith he provok the lord god of israel to anger.

15:31 now the rest of the act of nadab, and all that he did, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
15:32 and there wa war between asa and baasha king of israel all
their days.

15:33 In the third year of asa king of judah began baasha the son of
ahijah to reign over all israel in tirzah, twenti and four years.

15:34 and he did evil in the sight of the lord, and walk in the way
of jeroboam, and in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin.

16:1 then the word of the lord came to jehu the son of hanani against
baasha, saying, 16:2 forasmuch as I exalt thee out of the dust, and
mad thee princ over my peopl israel; and thou hast walk in the
way of jeroboam, and hast made my peopl israel to sin, to provok me
to anger with their sins; 16:3 behold, I will take away the posterity
of baasha, and the poster of hi house; and will make thi house
lik the hous of jeroboam the son of nebat.

16:4 him that dieth of baasha in the citi shall the dog eat; and him
that dieth of hi in the field shall the fowl of the air eat.

16:5 now the rest of the act of baasha, and what he did, and his
might, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the kings
of israel?  16:6 So baasha slept with hi fathers, and wa buri in
tirzah: and elah hi son reign in hi stead.

16:7 and also by the hand of the prophet jehu the son of hanani came
th word of the lord against baasha, and against hi house, even for
al the evil that he did in the sight of the lord, in provok him to
ang with the work of hi hands, in be like the hous of jeroboam;
and becaus he kill him.

16:8 In the twenti and sixth year of asa king of judah began elah the
son of baasha to reign over israel in tirzah, two years.

16:9 and hi servant zimri, captain of half hi chariots, conspired
against him, as he wa in tirzah, drink himself drunk in the house
of arza steward of hi hous in tirzah.

16:10 and zimri went in and smote him, and kill him, in the twenty
and seventh year of asa king of judah, and reign in hi stead.

16:11 and it came to pass, when he began to reign, as soon as he sat
on hi throne, that he slew all the hous of baasha: he left him not
on that pisseth against a wall, neither of hi kinsfolks, nor of his
friends.

16:12 thu did zimri destroy all the hous of baasha, accord to the
word of the lord, which he spake against baasha by jehu the prophet.

16:13 for all the sin of baasha, and the sin of elah hi son, by
which they sinned, and by which they made israel to sin, in provoking
th lord god of israel to anger with their vanities.

16:14 now the rest of the act of elah, and all that he did, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
16:15 In the twenti and seventh year of asa king of judah did zimri
reign seven day in tirzah. and the peopl were encamp against
gibbethon, which belong to the philistines.

16:16 and the peopl that were encamp heard say, zimri hath
conspired, and hath also slain the king: wherefor all israel made
omri, the captain of the host, king over israel that day in the camp.

16:17 and omri went up from gibbethon, and all israel with him, and
they besieg tirzah.

16:18 and it came to pass, when zimri saw that the citi wa taken,
that he went into the palac of the king' house, and burnt the king's
hous over him with fire, and died.

16:19 for hi sin which he sin in do evil in the sight of the
lord, in walk in the way of jeroboam, and in hi sin which he did,
to make israel to sin.

16:20 now the rest of the act of zimri, and hi treason that he
wrought, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
k of israel?  16:21 then were the peopl of israel divid into
two parts: half of the peopl follow tibni the son of ginath, to
mak him king; and half follow omri.

16:22 but the peopl that follow omri prevail against the people
that follow tibni the son of ginath: so tibni died, and omri
reigned.

16:23 In the thirti and first year of asa king of judah began omri to
reign over israel, twelv years: six year reign he in tirzah.

16:24 and he bought the hill samaria of shemer for two talent of
silver, and built on the hill, and call the name of the citi which
h built, after the name of shemer, owner of the hill, samaria.

16:25 but omri wrought evil in the eye of the lord, and did worse
than all that were befor him.

16:26 for he walk in all the way of jeroboam the son of nebat, and
in hi sin wherewith he made israel to sin, to provok the lord god of
israel to anger with their vanities.

16:27 now the rest of the act of omri which he did, and hi might
that he shewed, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of
th king of israel?  16:28 So omri slept with hi fathers, and was
buri in samaria: and ahab hi son reign in hi stead.

16:29 and in the thirti and eighth year of asa king of judah began
ahab the son of omri to reign over israel: and ahab the son of omri
reign over israel in samaria twenti and two years.

16:30 and ahab the son of omri did evil in the sight of the lord above
al that were befor him.

16:31 and it came to pass, as if it had been a light thing for him to
walk in the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, that he took to wife
jezebel the daughter of ethbaal king of the zidonians, and went and
serv baal, and worship him.

16:32 and he rear up an altar for baal in the hous of baal, which
h had built in samaria.

16:33 and ahab made a grove; and ahab did more to provok the lord god
of israel to anger than all the king of israel that were befor him.

16:34 In hi day did hiel the bethelit build jericho: he laid the
found thereof in abiram hi firstborn, and set up the gates
thereof in hi youngest son segub, accord to the word of the lord,
which he spake by joshua the son of nun.

17:1 and elijah the tishbite, who wa of the inhabit of gilead,
said unto ahab, As the lord god of israel liveth, befor whom I stand,
ther shall not be dew nor rain these years, but accord to my word.

17:2 and the word of the lord came unto him, saying, 17:3 get thee
hence, and turn thee eastward, and hide thyself by the brook cherith,
that is befor jordan.

17:4 and it shall be, that thou shalt drink of the brook; and I have
command the raven to feed thee there.

17:5 So he went and did accord unto the word of the lord: for he
went and dwelt by the brook cherith, that is befor jordan.

17:6 and the raven brought him bread and flesh in the morning, and
bread and flesh in the evening; and he drank of the brook.

17:7 and it came to pass after a while, that the brook dri up,
becaus there had been no rain in the land.

17:8 and the word of the lord came unto him, saying, 17:9 arise, get
the to zarephath, which belongeth to zidon, and dwell there: behold,
i have command a widow woman there to sustain thee.

17:10 So he aros and went to zarephath. and when he came to the gate
of the city, behold, the widow woman wa there gather of sticks:
and he call to her, and said, fetch me, I pray thee, a littl water
in a vessel, that I may drink.

17:11 and as she wa go to fetch it, he call to her, and said,
br me, I pray thee, a morsel of bread in thine hand.

17:12 and she said, As the lord thi god liveth, I have not a cake, but
an hand of meal in a barrel, and a littl oil in a cruse: and,
behold, I am gather two sticks, that I may go in and dress it for
m and my son, that we may eat it, and die.

17:13 and elijah said unto her, fear not; go and do as thou hast said:
but make me thereof a littl cake first, and bring it unto me, and
aft make for thee and for thi son.

17:14 for thu saith the lord god of israel, the barrel of meal shall
not waste, neither shall the cruse of oil fail, until the day that the
lord sendeth rain upon the earth.

17:15 and she went and did accord to the say of elijah: and she,
and he, and her house, did eat mani days.

17:16 and the barrel of meal wast not, neither did the cruse of oil
fail, accord to the word of the lord, which he spake by elijah.

17:17 and it came to pass after these things, that the son of the
woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and hi sick wa so
sore, that there wa no breath left in him.

17:18 and she said unto elijah, what have I to do with thee, O thou
man of god? art thou come unto me to call my sin to remembrance, and
to slay my son?  17:19 and he said unto her, give me thi son. and he
took him out of her bosom, and carri him up into a loft, where he
abode, and laid him upon hi own bed.

17:20 and he cri unto the lord, and said, O lord my god, hast thou
also brought evil upon the widow with whom I sojourn, by slay her
son?  17:21 and he stretch himself upon the child three times, and
cri unto the lord, and said, O lord my god, I pray thee, let this
child' soul come into him again.

17:22 and the lord heard the voic of elijah; and the soul of the
child came into him again, and he revived.

17:23 and elijah took the child, and brought him down out of the
chamb into the house, and deliv him unto hi mother: and elijah
said, see, thi son liveth.

17:24 and the woman said to elijah, now by thi I know that thou art a
man of god, and that the word of the lord in thi mouth is truth.

18:1 and it came to pass after mani days, that the word of the lord
cam to elijah in the third year, saying, go, shew thyself unto ahab;
and I will send rain upon the earth.

18:2 and elijah went to shew himself unto ahab. and there wa a sore
famin in samaria.

18:3 and ahab call obadiah, which wa the governor of hi house.
(now obadiah fear the lord greatly: 18:4 for it wa so, when jezebel
cut off the prophet of the lord, that obadiah took an hundred
prophets, and hid them by fifti in a cave, and fed them with bread and
water.)  18:5 and ahab said unto obadiah, Go into the land, unto all
fountain of water, and unto all brooks: peradventur we may find
grass to save the hors and mule alive, that we lose not all the
beasts.

18:6 So they divid the land between them to pass throughout it: ahab
w one way by himself, and obadiah went anoth way by himself.

18:7 and as obadiah wa in the way, behold, elijah met him: and he
knew him, and fell on hi face, and said, art thou that my lord
elijah?  18:8 and he answer him, I am: go, tell thi lord, behold,
elijah is here.

18:9 and he said, what have I sinned, that thou wouldest deliv thy
serv into the hand of ahab, to slay me?  18:10 As the lord thi god
liveth, there is no nation or kingdom, whither my lord hath not sent
to seek thee: and when they said, He is not there; he took an oath of
th kingdom and nation, that they found thee not.

18:11 and now thou sayest, go, tell thi lord, behold, elijah is here.

18:12 and it shall come to pass, as soon as I am gone from thee, that
th spirit of the lord shall carri thee whither I know not; and so
when I come and tell ahab, and he cannot find thee, he shall slay me:
but I thi servant fear the lord from my youth.

18:13 wa it not told my lord what I did when jezebel slew the
prophet of the lord, how I hid an hundr men of the lord' prophets
bi fifti in a cave, and fed them with bread and water?  18:14 and now
thou sayest, go, tell thi lord, behold, elijah is here: and he shall
slay me.

18:15 and elijah said, As the lord of host liveth, befor whom i
stand, I will sure shew myself unto him to day.

18:16 So obadiah went to meet ahab, and told him: and ahab went to
meet elijah.

18:17 and it came to pass, when ahab saw elijah, that ahab said unto
him, art thou he that troubleth israel?  18:18 and he answered, I have
not troubl israel; but thou, and thi father' house, in that ye have
forsaken the command of the lord, and thou hast follow baalim.

18:19 now therefor send, and gather to me all israel unto mount
carmel, and the prophet of baal four hundr and fifty, and the
prophet of the grove four hundred, which eat at jezebel' table.

18:20 So ahab sent unto all the children of israel, and gather the
prophet togeth unto mount carmel.

18:21 and elijah came unto all the people, and said, how long halt ye
between two opinions? if the lord be god, follow him: but if baal,
then follow him. and the peopl answer him not a word.

18:22 then said elijah unto the people, I, even I only, remain a
prophet of the lord; but baal' prophet are four hundr and fifty
men.

18:23 let them therefor give us two bullocks; and let them choos one
bullock for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on wood, and
put no fire under: and I will dress the other bullock, and lay it on
wood, and put no fire under: 18:24 and call ye on the name of your
gods, and I will call on the name of the lord: and the god that
answereth by fire, let him be god. and all the peopl answer and
said, It is well spoken.

18:25 and elijah said unto the prophet of baal, choos you one
bullock for yourselves, and dress it first; for ye are many; and call
on the name of your gods, but put no fire under.

18:26 and they took the bullock which wa given them, and they dressed
it, and call on the name of baal from morn even until noon,
saying, O baal, hear us. but there wa no voice, nor ani that
answered. and they leap upon the altar which wa made.

18:27 and it came to pass at noon, that elijah mock them, and said,
cri aloud: for he is a god; either he is talking, or he is pursuing,
or he is in a journey, or peradventur he sleepeth, and must be
awaked.

18:28 and they cri aloud, and cut themselv after their manner with
kniv and lancets, till the blood gush out upon them.

18:29 and it came to pass, when midday wa past, and they prophesied
until the time of the offer of the even sacrifice, that there
wa neither voice, nor ani to answer, nor ani that regarded.

18:30 and elijah said unto all the people, come near unto me. and all
th peopl came near unto him. and he repair the altar of the lord
that wa broken down.

18:31 and elijah took twelv stones, accord to the number of the
trib of the son of jacob, unto whom the word of the lord came,
saying, israel shall be thi name: 18:32 and with the stone he built
an altar in the name of the lord: and he made a trench about the
altar, as great as would contain two measur of seed.

18:33 and he put the wood in order, and cut the bullock in pieces, and
laid him on the wood, and said, fill four barrel with water, and pour
it on the burnt sacrifice, and on the wood.

18:34 and he said, Do it the second time. and they did it the second
time.

and he said, Do it the third time. and they did it the third time.

18:35 and the water ran round about the altar; and he fill the
trench also with water.

18:36 and it came to pass at the time of the offer of the evening
sacrifice, that elijah the prophet came near, and said, lord god of
abraham, isaac, and of israel, let it be known thi day that thou art
god in israel, and that I am thi servant, and that I have done all
thes thing at thi word.

18:37 hear me, O lord, hear me, that thi peopl may know that thou
art the lord god, and that thou hast turn their heart back again.

18:38 then the fire of the lord fell, and consum the burnt
sacrifice, and the wood, and the stones, and the dust, and lick up
th water that wa in the trench.

18:39 and when all the peopl saw it, they fell on their faces: and
they said, the lord, he is the god; the lord, he is the god.

18:40 and elijah said unto them, take the prophet of baal; let not
on of them escape. and they took them: and elijah brought them down
to the brook kishon, and slew them there.

18:41 and elijah said unto ahab, get thee up, eat and drink; for there
i a sound of abund of rain.

18:42 So ahab went up to eat and to drink. and elijah went up to the
top of carmel; and he cast himself down upon the earth, and put his
fac between hi knees, 18:43 and said to hi servant, Go up now, look
toward the sea. and he went up, and looked, and said, there is
nothing. and he said, Go again seven times.

18:44 and it came to pass at the seventh time, that he said, behold,
ther ariseth a littl cloud out of the sea, like a man' hand. and he
said, Go up, say unto ahab, prepar thi chariot, and get thee down
that the rain stop thee not.

18:45 and it came to pass in the mean while, that the heaven wa black
with cloud and wind, and there wa a great rain. and ahab rode, and
went to jezreel.

18:46 and the hand of the lord wa on elijah; and he gird up his
loins, and ran befor ahab to the entranc of jezreel.

19:1 and ahab told jezebel all that elijah had done, and withal how he
had slain all the prophet with the sword.

19:2 then jezebel sent a messeng unto elijah, saying, So let the
god do to me, and more also, if I make not thi life as the life of
on of them by to morrow about thi time.

19:3 and when he saw that, he arose, and went for hi life, and came
to beersheba, which belongeth to judah, and left hi servant there.

19:4 but he himself went a day' journey into the wilderness, and came
and sat down under a junip tree: and he request for himself that
h might die; and said, It is enough; now, O lord, take away my life;
for I am not better than my fathers.

19:5 and as he lay and slept under a junip tree, behold, then an
angel touch him, and said unto him, aris and eat.

19:6 and he looked, and, behold, there wa a cake baken on the coals,
and a cruse of water at hi head. and he did eat and drink, and laid
him down again.

19:7 and the angel of the lord came again the second time, and touched
him, and said, aris and eat; becaus the journey is too great for
thee.

19:8 and he arose, and did eat and drink, and went in the strength of
that meat forti day and forti night unto horeb the mount of god.

19:9 and he came thither unto a cave, and lodg there; and, behold,
th word of the lord came to him, and he said unto him, what doest
thou here, elijah?  19:10 and he said, I have been veri jealou for
th lord god of hosts: for the children of israel have forsaken thy
covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thi prophet with the
sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it
away.

19:11 and he said, Go forth, and stand upon the mount befor the lord.

and, behold, the lord pass by, and a great and strong wind rent the
mountains, and brake in piec the rock befor the lord; but the lord
wa not in the wind: and after the wind an earthquake; but the lord
wa not in the earthquake: 19:12 and after the earthquak a fire; but
th lord wa not in the fire: and after the fire a still small voice.

19:13 and it wa so, when elijah heard it, that he wrap hi face in
hi mantle, and went out, and stood in the enter in of the cave.
and, behold, there came a voic unto him, and said, what doest thou
here, elijah?  19:14 and he said, I have been veri jealou for the
lord god of hosts: becaus the children of israel have forsaken thy
covenant, thrown down thine altars, and slain thi prophet with the
sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it
away.

19:15 and the lord said unto him, go, return on thi way to the
wild of damascus: and when thou comest, anoint hazael to be king
ov syria: 19:16 and jehu the son of nimshi shalt thou anoint to be
k over israel: and elisha the son of shaphat of abelmeholah shalt
thou anoint to be prophet in thi room.

19:17 and it shall come to pass, that him that escapeth the sword of
hazael shall jehu slay: and him that escapeth from the sword of jehu
shal elisha slay.

19:18 yet I have left me seven thousand in israel, all the knee which
hav not bow unto baal, and everi mouth which hath not kiss him.

19:19 So he depart thence, and found elisha the son of shaphat, who
wa plow with twelv yoke of oxen befor him, and he with the
twelfth: and elijah pass by him, and cast hi mantl upon him.

19:20 and he left the oxen, and ran after elijah, and said, let me, i
pray thee, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow thee.
and he said unto him, Go back again: for what have I done to thee?
19:21 and he return back from him, and took a yoke of oxen, and slew
them, and boil their flesh with the instrument of the oxen, and
gav unto the people, and they did eat. then he arose, and went after
elijah, and minist unto him.

20:1 and benhadad the king of syria gather all hi host together:
and there were thirti and two king with him, and horses, and
chariots; and he went up and besieg samaria, and war against it.

20:2 and he sent messeng to ahab king of israel into the city, and
said unto him, thu saith benhadad, 20:3 thi silver and thi gold is
mine; thi wive also and thi children, even the goodliest, are mine.

20:4 and the king of israel answer and said, My lord, O king,
accord to thi saying, I am thine, and all that I have.

20:5 and the messeng came again, and said, thu speaketh benhadad,
saying, although I have sent unto thee, saying, thou shalt deliv me
thi silver, and thi gold, and thi wives, and thi children; 20:6 yet i
wil send my servant unto thee to morrow about thi time, and they
shal search thine house, and the hous of thi servants; and it shall
be, that whatsoev is pleasant in thine eyes, they shall put it in
their hand, and take it away.

20:7 then the king of israel call all the elder of the land, and
said, mark, I pray you, and see how thi man seeketh mischief: for he
sent unto me for my wives, and for my children, and for my silver, and
for my gold; and I deni him not.

20:8 and all the elder and all the peopl said unto him, hearken not
unto him, nor consent.

20:9 wherefor he said unto the messeng of benhadad, tell my lord
th king, all that thou didst send for to thi servant at the first i
wil do: but thi thing I may not do. and the messeng departed, and
brought him word again.

20:10 and benhadad sent unto him, and said, the god do so unto me,
and more also, if the dust of samaria shall suffic for hand for
al the peopl that follow me.

20:11 and the king of israel answer and said, tell him, let not him
that girdeth on hi har boast himself as he that putteth it off.

20:12 and it came to pass, when ben-hadad heard thi message, as he
wa drinking, he and the king in the pavilions, that he said unto his
servants, set yourselv in array. and they set themselv in array
against the city.

20:13 and, behold, there came a prophet unto ahab king of israel,
saying, thu saith the lord, hast thou seen all thi great multitude?
behold, I will deliv it into thine hand thi day; and thou shalt
know that I am the lord.

20:14 and ahab said, By whom? and he said, thu saith the lord, even
bi the young men of the princ of the provinces. then he said, who
shal order the battle? and he answered, thou.

20:15 then he number the young men of the princ of the provinces,
and they were two hundr and thirti two: and after them he numbered
al the people, even all the children of israel, be seven thousand.

20:16 and they went out at noon. but benhadad wa drink himself
drunk in the pavilions, he and the kings, the thirti and two kings
that help him.

20:17 and the young men of the princ of the provinc went out
first; and benhadad sent out, and they told him, saying, there are men
com out of samaria.

20:18 and he said, whether they be come out for peace, take them
alive; or whether they be come out for war, take them alive.

20:19 So these young men of the princ of the provinc came out of
th city, and the armi which follow them.

20:20 and they slew everi one hi man: and the syrian fled; and
israel pursu them: and benhadad the king of syria escap on an
hors with the horsemen.

20:21 and the king of israel went out, and smote the hors and
chariots, and slew the syrian with a great slaughter.

20:22 and the prophet came to the king of israel, and said unto him,
go, strengthen thyself, and mark, and see what thou doest: for at the
return of the year the king of syria will come up against thee.

20:23 and the servant of the king of syria said unto him, their gods
ar god of the hills; therefor they were stronger than we; but let
u fight against them in the plain, and sure we shall be stronger
than they.

20:24 and do thi thing, take the king away, everi man out of his
place, and put captain in their rooms: 20:25 and number thee an army,
lik the armi that thou hast lost, hors for horse, and chariot for
chariot: and we will fight against them in the plain, and sure we
shal be stronger than they. and he hearken unto their voice, and
did so.

20:26 and it came to pass at the return of the year, that benhadad
numb the syrians, and went up to aphek, to fight against israel.

20:27 and the children of israel were numbered, and were all present,
and went against them: and the children of israel pitch befor them
lik two littl flock of kids; but the syrian fill the country.

20:28 and there came a man of god, and spake unto the king of israel,
and said, thu saith the lord, becaus the syrian have said, the lord
i god of the hills, but he is not god of the valleys, therefor will
i deliv all thi great multitud into thine hand, and ye shall know
that I am the lord.

20:29 and they pitch one over against the other seven days. and so
it was, that in the seventh day the battl wa joined: and the
children of israel slew of the syrian an hundr thousand footmen in
on day.

20:30 but the rest fled to aphek, into the city; and there a wall fell
upon twenti and seven thousand of the men that were left. and benhadad
fled, and came into the city, into an inner chamber.

20:31 and hi servant said unto him, behold now, we have heard that
th king of the hous of israel are merci kings: let us, I pray
thee, put sackcloth on our loins, and rope upon our heads, and go out
to the king of israel: peradventur he will save thi life.

20:32 So they gird sackcloth on their loins, and put rope on their
heads, and came to the king of israel, and said, thi servant benhadad
saith, I pray thee, let me live. and he said, Is he yet alive? he is
mi brother.

20:33 now the men did dilig observ whether ani thing would come
from him, and did hastili catch it: and they said, thi brother
benhadad. then he said, Go ye, bring him. then benhadad came forth to
him; and he caus him to come up into the chariot.

20:34 and ben-hadad said unto him, the cities, which my father took
from thi father, I will restore; and thou shalt make street for thee
in damascus, as my father made in samaria. then said ahab, I will send
the away with thi covenant. So he made a coven with him, and sent
him away.

20:35 and a certain man of the son of the prophet said unto his
neighbour in the word of the lord, smite me, I pray thee. and the man
refus to smite him.

20:36 then said he unto him, becaus thou hast not obey the voic of
th lord, behold, as soon as thou art depart from me, a lion shall
slay thee.

and as soon as he wa depart from him, a lion found him, and slew
him.

20:37 then he found anoth man, and said, smite me, I pray thee. and
th man smote him, so that in smite he wound him.

20:38 So the prophet departed, and wait for the king by the way, and
disguis himself with ash upon hi face.

20:39 and as the king pass by, he cri unto the king: and he said,
thi servant went out into the midst of the battle; and, behold, a man
turn aside, and brought a man unto me, and said, keep thi man: if
bi ani mean he be missing, then shall thi life be for hi life, or
els thou shalt pay a talent of silver.

20:40 and as thi servant wa busi here and there, he wa gone. and the
k of israel said unto him, So shall thi judgment be; thyself hast
decid it.

20:41 and he hasted, and took the ash away from hi face; and the
k of israel discern him that he wa of the prophets.

20:42 and he said unto him, thu saith the lord, becaus thou hast let
go out of thi hand a man whom I appoint to utter destruction,
therefor thi life shall go for hi life, and thi peopl for his
people.

20:43 and the king of israel went to hi hous heavi and displeased,
and came to samaria.

21:1 and it came to pass after these things, that naboth the
jezreelit had a vineyard, which wa in jezreel, hard by the palac of
ahab king of samaria.

21:2 and ahab spake unto naboth, saying, give me thi vineyard, that i
may have it for a garden of herbs, becaus it is near unto my house:
and I will give thee for it a better vineyard than it; or, if it seem
good to thee, I will give thee the worth of it in money.

21:3 and naboth said to ahab, the lord forbid it me, that I should
giv the inherit of my father unto thee.

21:4 and ahab came into hi hous heavi and displeas becaus of the
word which naboth the jezreelit had spoken to him: for he had said, i
wil not give thee the inherit of my fathers. and he laid him down
upon hi bed, and turn away hi face, and would eat no bread.

21:5 but jezebel hi wife came to him, and said unto him, whi is thy
spirit so sad, that thou eatest no bread?  21:6 and he said unto her,
becaus I spake unto naboth the jezreelite, and said unto him, give me
thi vineyard for money; or else, if it pleas thee, I will give thee
anoth vineyard for it: and he answered, I will not give thee my
vineyard.

21:7 and jezebel hi wife said unto him, dost thou now govern the
kingdom of israel? arise, and eat bread, and let thine heart be merry:
i will give thee the vineyard of naboth the jezreelite.

21:8 So she wrote letter in ahab' name, and seal them with his
seal, and sent the letter unto the elder and to the nobl that were
in hi city, dwell with naboth.

21:9 and she wrote in the letters, saying, proclaim a fast, and set
naboth on high among the people: 21:10 and set two men, son of
belial, befor him, to bear wit against him, saying, thou didst
blasphem god and the king. and then carri him out, and stone him,
that he may die.

21:11 and the men of hi city, even the elder and the nobl who were
th inhabit in hi city, did as jezebel had sent unto them, and as
it wa written in the letter which she had sent unto them.

21:12 they proclaim a fast, and set naboth on high among the people.

21:13 and there came in two men, children of belial, and sat before
him: and the men of belial wit against him, even against naboth,
in the presenc of the people, saying, naboth did blasphem god and
th king. then they carri him forth out of the city, and stone him
with stones, that he died.

21:14 then they sent to jezebel, saying, naboth is stoned, and is
dead.

21:15 and it came to pass, when jezebel heard that naboth wa stoned,
and wa dead, that jezebel said to ahab, arise, take possess of the
vineyard of naboth the jezreelite, which he refus to give thee for
money: for naboth is not alive, but dead.

21:16 and it came to pass, when ahab heard that naboth wa dead, that
ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of naboth the jezreelite, to
tak possess of it.

21:17 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbite, saying,
21:18 arise, go down to meet ahab king of israel, which is in samaria:
behold, he is in the vineyard of naboth, whither he is gone down to
possess it.

21:19 and thou shalt speak unto him, saying, thu saith the lord, hast
thou killed, and also taken possession? and thou shalt speak unto him,
saying, thu saith the lord, In the place where dog lick the blood
of naboth shall dog lick thi blood, even thine.

21:20 and ahab said to elijah, hast thou found me, O mine enemy? and
h answered, I have found thee: becaus thou hast sold thyself to work
evil in the sight of the lord.

21:21 behold, I will bring evil upon thee, and will take away thy
posterity, and will cut off from ahab him that pisseth against the
wall, and him that is shut up and left in israel, 21:22 and will make
thin hous like the hous of jeroboam the son of nebat, and like the
hous of baasha the son of ahijah, for the provoc wherewith thou
hast provok me to anger, and made israel to sin.

21:23 and of jezebel also spake the lord, saying, the dog shall eat
jezebel by the wall of jezreel.

21:24 him that dieth of ahab in the citi the dog shall eat; and him
that dieth in the field shall the fowl of the air eat.

21:25 but there wa none like unto ahab, which did sell himself to
work wicked in the sight of the lord, whom jezebel hi wife
stir up.

21:26 and he did veri abomin in follow idols, accord to all
th as did the amorites, whom the lord cast out befor the children
of israel.

21:27 and it came to pass, when ahab heard those words, that he rent
hi clothes, and put sackcloth upon hi flesh, and fasted, and lay in
sackcloth, and went softly.

21:28 and the word of the lord came to elijah the tishbite, saying,
21:29 seest thou how ahab humbleth himself befor me? becaus he
humbleth himself befor me, I will not bring the evil in hi days: but
in hi son' day will I bring the evil upon hi house.

22:1 and they continu three year without war between syria and
israel.

22:2 and it came to pass in the third year, that jehoshaphat the king
of judah came down to the king of israel.

22:3 and the king of israel said unto hi servants, know ye that
ramoth in gilead is ours, and we be still, and take it not out of the
hand of the king of syria?  22:4 and he said unto jehoshaphat, wilt
thou go with me to battl to ramothgilead? and jehoshaphat said to the
k of israel, I am as thou art, my peopl as thi people, my horses
a thi horses.

22:5 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel, enquire, I pray
thee, at the word of the lord to day.

22:6 then the king of israel gather the prophet together, about
four hundr men, and said unto them, shall I go against ramothgilead
to battle, or shall I forbear? and they said, Go up; for the lord
shal deliv it into the hand of the king.

22:7 and jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the lord
besides, that we might enquir of him?  22:8 and the king of israel
said unto jehoshaphat, there is yet one man, micaiah the son of imlah,
bi whom we may enquir of the lord: but I hate him; for he doth not
prophesi good concern me, but evil. and jehoshaphat said, let not
th king say so.

22:9 then the king of israel call an officer, and said, hasten
hith micaiah the son of imlah.

22:10 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah sat
each on hi throne, have put on their robes, in a void place in the
entr of the gate of samaria; and all the prophet prophesied
befor them.

22:11 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah made him horn of iron: and he
said, thu saith the lord, with these shalt thou push the syrians,
until thou have consum them.

22:12 and all the prophet prophesi so, saying, Go up to
ramothgilead, and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into the
king' hand.

22:13 and the messeng that wa gone to call micaiah spake unto him,
saying, behold now, the word of the prophet declar good unto the
k with one mouth: let thi word, I pray thee, be like the word of
on of them, and speak that which is good.

22:14 and micaiah said, As the lord liveth, what the lord saith unto
me, that will I speak.

22:15 So he came to the king. and the king said unto him, micaiah,
shal we go against ramothgilead to battle, or shall we forbear? and
h answer him, go, and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into
th hand of the king.

22:16 and the king said unto him, how mani time shall I adjur thee
that thou tell me noth but that which is true in the name of the
lord?  22:17 and he said, I saw all israel scatter upon the hills,
a sheep that have not a shepherd: and the lord said, these have no
master: let them return everi man to hi hous in peace.

22:18 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat, did I not tell
the that he would prophesi no good concern me, but evil?  22:19
and he said, hear thou therefor the word of the lord: I saw the lord
sit on hi throne, and all the host of heaven stand by him on
hi right hand and on hi left.

22:20 and the lord said, who shall persuad ahab, that he may go up
and fall at ramothgilead? and one said on thi manner, and another
said on that manner.

22:21 and there came forth a spirit, and stood befor the lord, and
said, I will persuad him.

22:22 and the lord said unto him, wherewith? and he said, I will go
forth, and I will be a lie spirit in the mouth of all hi prophets.
and he said, thou shalt persud him, and prevail also: go forth, and
do so.

22:23 now therefore, behold, the lord hath put a lie spirit in the
mouth of all these thi prophets, and the lord hath spoken evil
concern thee.

22:24 but zedekiah the son of chenaanah went near, and smote micaiah
on the cheek, and said, which way went the spirit of the lord from me
to speak unto thee?  22:25 and micaiah said, behold, thou shalt see in
that day, when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.

22:26 and the king of israel said, take micaiah, and carri him back
unto amon the governor of the city, and to joash the king' son; 22:27
and say, thu saith the king, put thi fellow in the prison, and feed
him with bread of afflict and with water of affliction, until i
com in peace.

22:28 and micaiah said, If thou return at all in peace, the lord hath
not spoken by me. and he said, hearken, O people, everi one of you.

22:29 So the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up
to ramothgilead.

22:30 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat, I will disguise
myself, and enter into the battle; but put thou on thi robes. and the
k of israel disguis himself, and went into the battle.

22:31 but the king of syria command hi thirti and two captain that
had rule over hi chariots, saying, fight neither with small nor
great, save onli with the king of israel.

22:32 and it came to pass, when the captain of the chariot saw
jehoshaphat, that they said, sure it is the king of israel. and they
turn asid to fight against him: and jehoshaphat cri out.

22:33 and it came to pass, when the captain of the chariot perceived
that it wa not the king of israel, that they turn back from
pursu him.

22:34 and a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of
israel between the joint of the harness: wherefor he said unto the
driv of hi chariot, turn thine hand, and carri me out of the host;
for I am wounded.

22:35 and the battl increas that day: and the king wa stay up in
hi chariot against the syrians, and die at even: and the blood ran
out of the wound into the midst of the chariot.

22:36 and there went a proclam throughout the host about the
go down of the sun, saying, everi man to hi city, and everi man to
hi own country.

22:37 So the king died, and wa brought to samaria; and they buried
th king in samaria.

22:38 and one wash the chariot in the pool of samaria; and the dogs
lick up hi blood; and they wash hi armour; accord unto the
word of the lord which he spake.

22:39 now the rest of the act of ahab, and all that he did, and the
ivori hous which he made, and all the citi that he built, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
22:40 So ahab slept with hi fathers; and ahaziah hi son reign in
hi stead.

22:41 and jehoshaphat the son of asa began to reign over judah in the
fourth year of ahab king of israel.

22:42 jehoshaphat wa thirti and five year old when he began to
reign; and he reign twenti and five year in jerusalem. and his
mother' name wa azubah the daughter of shilhi.

22:43 and he walk in all the way of asa hi father; he turn not
asid from it, do that which wa right in the eye of the lord:
nevertheless the high place were not taken away; for the people
off and burnt incens yet in the high places.

22:44 and jehoshaphat made peac with the king of israel.

22:45 now the rest of the act of jehoshaphat, and hi might that he
shewed, and how he warred, are they not written in the book of the
chronicl of the king of judah?  22:46 and the remnant of the
sodomites, which remain in the day of hi father asa, he took out
of the land.

22:47 there wa then no king in edom: a deputi wa king.

22:48 jehoshaphat made ship of tharshish to go to ophir for gold: but
they went not; for the ship were broken at eziongeber.

22:49 then said ahaziah the son of ahab unto jehoshaphat, let my
serv go with thi servant in the ships. but jehoshaphat would not.

22:50 and jehoshaphat slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with his
fath in the citi of david hi father: and jehoram hi son reigned
in hi stead.

22:51 ahaziah the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria
th seventeenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah, and reign two
year over israel.

22:52 and he did evil in the sight of the lord, and walk in the way
of hi father, and in the way of hi mother, and in the way of
jeroboam the son of nebat, who made israel to sin: 22:53 for he served
baal, and worship him, and provok to anger the lord god of
israel, accord to all that hi father had done.




th second book of the kings

commonli called:

th fourth book of the kings


1:1 then moab rebel against israel after the death of ahab.

1:2 and ahaziah fell down through a lattic in hi upper chamber that
wa in samaria, and wa sick: and he sent messengers, and said unto
them, go, enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron whether I shall
recov of thi disease.

1:3 but the angel of the lord said to elijah the tishbite, arise, go
up to meet the messeng of the king of samaria, and say unto them,
i it not becaus there is not a god in israel, that ye go to enquire
of baalzebub the god of ekron?  1:4 now therefor thu saith the lord,
thou shalt not come down from that bed on which thou art gone up, but
shalt sure die. and elijah departed.

1:5 and when the messeng turn back unto him, he said unto them,
whi are ye now turn back?  1:6 and they said unto him, there came a
man up to meet us, and said unto us, go, turn again unto the king that
sent you, and say unto him, thu saith the lord, Is it not because
ther is not a god in israel, that thou sendest to enquir of
baalzebub the god of ekron? therefor thou shalt not come down from
that bed on which thou art gone up, but shalt sure die.

1:7 and he said unto them, what manner of man wa he which came up to
meet you, and told you these words?  1:8 and they answer him, He was
an hairi man, and girt with a girdl of leather about hi loins. and
h said, It is elijah the tishbite.

1:9 then the king sent unto him a captain of fifti with hi fifty. and
h went up to him: and, behold, he sat on the top of an hill. and he
spak unto him, thou man of god, the king hath said, come down.

1:10 and elijah answer and said to the captain of fifty, If I be a
man of god, then let fire come down from heaven, and consum thee and
thi fifty.

and there came down fire from heaven, and consum him and hi fifty.

1:11 again also he sent unto him anoth captain of fifti with his
fifty.

and he answer and said unto him, O man of god, thu hath the king
said, come down quickly.

1:12 and elijah answer and said unto them, If I be a man of god, let
fir come down from heaven, and consum thee and thi fifty. and the
fir of god came down from heaven, and consum him and hi fifty.

1:13 and he sent again a captain of the third fifti with hi fifty.
and the third captain of fifti went up, and came and fell on hi knees
befor elijah, and besought him, and said unto him, O man of god, i
pray thee, let my life, and the life of these fifti thi servants, be
preci in thi sight.

1:14 behold, there came fire down from heaven, and burnt up the two
captain of the former fifti with their fifties: therefor let my
lif now be preciou in thi sight.

1:15 and the angel of the lord said unto elijah, Go down with him: be
not afraid of him. and he arose, and went down with him unto the king.

1:16 and he said unto him, thu saith the lord, forasmuch as thou hast
sent messeng to enquir of baalzebub the god of ekron, is it not
becaus there is no god in israel to enquir of hi word? therefore
th shalt not come down off that bed on which thou art gone up, but
shalt sure die.

1:17 So he die accord to the word of the lord which elijah had
spoken.

and jehoram reign in hi stead in the second year of jehoram the son
of jehoshaphat king of judah; becaus he had no son.

1:18 now the rest of the act of ahaziah which he did, are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?  2:1 and
it came to pass, when the lord would take up elijah into heaven by a
whirlwind, that elijah went with elisha from gilgal.

2:2 and elijah said unto elisha, tarri here, I pray thee; for the lord
hath sent me to bethel. and elisha said unto him, As the lord liveth,
and as thi soul liveth, I will not leav thee. So they went down to
bethel.

2:3 and the son of the prophet that were at bethel came forth to
elisha, and said unto him, knowest thou that the lord will take away
thi master from thi head to day? and he said, yea, I know it; hold ye
your peace.

2:4 and elijah said unto him, elisha, tarri here, I pray thee; for the
lord hath sent me to jericho. and he said, As the lord liveth, and as
thi soul liveth, I will not leav thee. So they came to jericho.

2:5 and the son of the prophet that were at jericho came to elisha,
and said unto him, knowest thou that the lord will take away thy
mast from thi head to day? and he answered, yea, I know it; hold ye
your peace.

2:6 and elijah said unto him, tarry, I pray thee, here; for the lord
hath sent me to jordan. and he said, As the lord liveth, and as thy
soul liveth, I will not leav thee. and they two went on.

2:7 and fifti men of the son of the prophet went, and stood to view
afar off: and they two stood by jordan.

2:8 and elijah took hi mantle, and wrap it together, and smote the
waters, and they were divid hither and thither, so that they two
went over on dri ground.

2:9 and it came to pass, when they were gone over, that elijah said
unto elisha, ask what I shall do for thee, befor I be taken away from
thee. and elisha said, I pray thee, let a doubl portion of thi spirit
b upon me.

2:10 and he said, thou hast ask a hard thing: nevertheless, if thou
se me when I am taken from thee, it shall be so unto thee; but if
not, it shall not be so.

2:11 and it came to pass, as they still went on, and talked, that,
behold, there appear a chariot of fire, and hors of fire, and
part them both asunder; and elijah went up by a whirlwind into
heaven.

2:12 and elisha saw it, and he cried, My father, my father, the
chariot of israel, and the horsemen thereof. and he saw him no more:
and he took hold of hi own clothes, and rent them in two pieces.

2:13 He took up also the mantl of elijah that fell from him, and went
back, and stood by the bank of jordan; 2:14 and he took the mantl of
elijah that fell from him, and smote the waters, and said, where is
th lord god of elijah? and when he also had smitten the waters, they
part hither and thither: and elisha went over.

2:15 and when the son of the prophet which were to view at jericho
saw him, they said, the spirit of elijah doth rest on elisha. and they
cam to meet him, and bow themselv to the ground befor him.

2:16 and they said unto him, behold now, there be with thi servants
fifti strong men; let them go, we pray thee, and seek thi master: lest
peradventur the spirit of the lord hath taken him up, and cast him
upon some mountain, or into some valley. and he said, Ye shall not
send.

2:17 and when they urg him till he wa ashamed, he said, send. they
sent therefor fifti men; and they sought three days, but found him
not.

2:18 and when they came again to him, (for he tarri at jericho,) he
said unto them, did I not say unto you, Go not?  2:19 and the men of
th citi said unto elisha, behold, I pray thee, the situat of this
citi is pleasant, as my lord seeth: but the water is naught, and the
ground barren.

2:20 and he said, bring me a new cruse, and put salt therein. and they
brought it to him.

2:21 and he went forth unto the spring of the waters, and cast the
salt in there, and said, thu saith the lord, I have heal these
waters; there shall not be from thenc ani more death or barren land.

2:22 So the water were heal unto thi day, accord to the saying
of elisha which he spake.

2:23 and he went up from thenc unto bethel: and as he wa go up by
th way, there came forth littl children out of the city, and mocked
him, and said unto him, Go up, thou bald head; go up, thou bald head.

2:24 and he turn back, and look on them, and curs them in the
nam of the lord. and there came forth two she bear out of the wood,
and tare forti and two children of them.

2:25 and he went from thenc to mount carmel, and from thenc he
return to samaria.

3:1 now jehoram the son of ahab began to reign over israel in samaria
th eighteenth year of jehoshaphat king of judah, and reign twelve
years.

3:2 and he wrought evil in the sight of the lord; but not like his
father, and like hi mother: for he put away the imag of baal that
hi father had made.

3:3 nevertheless he cleav unto the sin of jeroboam the son of
nebat, which made israel to sin; he depart not therefrom.

3:4 and mesha king of moab wa a sheepmaster, and render unto the
k of israel an hundr thousand lambs, and an hundr thousand
rams, with the wool.

3:5 but it came to pass, when ahab wa dead, that the king of moab
rebel against the king of israel.

3:6 and king jehoram went out of samaria the same time, and numbered
al israel.

3:7 and he went and sent to jehoshaphat the king of judah, saying, the
k of moab hath rebel against me: wilt thou go with me against
moab to battle? and he said, I will go up: I am as thou art, my people
a thi people, and my hors as thi horses.

3:8 and he said, which way shall we go up? and he answered, the way
through the wilder of edom.

3:9 So the king of israel went, and the king of judah, and the king of
edom: and they fetch a compass of seven days' journey: and there was
no water for the host, and for the cattl that follow them.

3:10 and the king of israel said, alas! that the lord hath called
thes three king together, to deliv them into the hand of moab!
3:11 but jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the lord,
that we may enquir of the lord by him? and one of the king of
israel' servant answer and said, here is elisha the son of
shaphat, which pour water on the hand of elijah.

3:12 and jehoshaphat said, the word of the lord is with him. So the
k of israel and jehoshaphat and the king of edom went down to him.

3:13 and elisha said unto the king of israel, what have I to do with
thee?  get thee to the prophet of thi father, and to the prophet of
thi mother.

and the king of israel said unto him, nay: for the lord hath called
thes three king together, to deliv them into the hand of moab.

3:14 and elisha said, As the lord of host liveth, befor whom i
stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presenc of jehoshaphat
th king of judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee.

3:15 but now bring me a minstrel. and it came to pass, when the
minstrel played, that the hand of the lord came upon him.

3:16 and he said, thu saith the lord, make thi valley full of
ditches.

3:17 for thu saith the lord, Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye
se rain; yet that valley shall be fill with water, that ye may
drink, both ye, and your cattle, and your beasts.

3:18 and thi is but a light thing in the sight of the lord: he will
deliv the moabit also into your hand.

3:19 and ye shall smite everi fenc city, and everi choic city, and
shal fell everi good tree, and stop all well of water, and mar every
good piec of land with stones.

3:20 and it came to pass in the morning, when the meat offer was
offered, that, behold, there came water by the way of edom, and the
countri wa fill with water.

3:21 and when all the moabit heard that the king were come up to
fight against them, they gather all that were abl to put on armour,
and upward, and stood in the border.

3:22 and they rose up earli in the morning, and the sun shone upon the
water, and the moabit saw the water on the other side as red as
blood: 3:23 and they said, thi is blood: the king are sure slain,
and they have smitten one another: now therefore, moab, to the spoil.

3:24 and when they came to the camp of israel, the israelit rose up
and smote the moabites, so that they fled befor them: but they went
forward smite the moabites, even in their country.

3:25 and they beat down the cities, and on everi good piec of land
cast everi man hi stone, and fill it; and they stop all the
wel of water, and fell all the good trees: onli in kirharaseth
left they the stone thereof; howbeit the slinger went about it, and
smot it.

3:26 and when the king of moab saw that the battl wa too sore for
him, he took with him seven hundr men that drew swords, to break
through even unto the king of edom: but they could not.

3:27 then he took hi eldest son that should have reign in his
stead, and offer him for a burnt offer upon the wall. and there
wa great indign against israel: and they depart from him, and
return to their own land.

4:1 now there cri a certain woman of the wive of the son of the
prophet unto elisha, saying, thi servant my husband is dead; and thou
knowest that thi servant did fear the lord: and the creditor is come
to take unto him my two son to be bondmen.

4:2 and elisha said unto her, what shall I do for thee? tell me, what
hast thou in the house? and she said, thine handmaid hath not any
th in the house, save a pot of oil.

4:3 then he said, go, borrow thee vessel abroad of all thy
neighbours, even empti vessels; borrow not a few.

4:4 and when thou art come in, thou shalt shut the door upon thee and
upon thi sons, and shalt pour out into all those vessels, and thou
shalt set asid that which is full.

4:5 So she went from him, and shut the door upon her and upon her
sons, who brought the vessel to her; and she pour out.

4:6 and it came to pass, when the vessel were full, that she said
unto her son, bring me yet a vessel. and he said unto her, there is
not a vessel more. and the oil stayed.

4:7 then she came and told the man of god. and he said, go, sell the
oil, and pay thi debt, and live thou and thi children of the rest.

4:8 and it fell on a day, that elisha pass to shunem, where wa a
great woman; and she constrain him to eat bread. and so it was, that
a oft as he pass by, he turn in thither to eat bread.

4:9 and she said unto her husband, behold now, I perceiv that thi is
an holi man of god, which passeth by us continually.

4:10 let us make a littl chamber, I pray thee, on the wall; and let
u set for him there a bed, and a table, and a stool, and a
candlestick: and it shall be, when he cometh to us, that he shall turn
in thither.

4:11 and it fell on a day, that he came thither, and he turn into
th chamber, and lay there.

4:12 and he said to gehazi hi servant, call thi shunammite. and when
h had call her, she stood befor him.

4:13 and he said unto him, say now unto her, behold, thou hast been
car for us with all thi care; what is to be done for thee?
wouldest thou be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the
host? and she answered, I dwell among mine own people.

4:14 and he said, what then is to be done for her? and gehazi
answered, verili she hath no child, and her husband is old.

4:15 and he said, call her. and when he had call her, she stood in
th door.

4:16 and he said, about thi season, accord to the time of life,
th shalt embrac a son. and she said, nay, my lord, thou man of god,
do not lie unto thine handmaid.

4:17 and the woman conceived, and bare a son at that season that
elisha had said unto her, accord to the time of life.

4:18 and when the child wa grown, it fell on a day, that he went out
to hi father to the reapers.

4:19 and he said unto hi father, My head, my head. and he said to a
lad, carri him to hi mother.

4:20 and when he had taken him, and brought him to hi mother, he sat
on her knee till noon, and then died.

4:21 and she went up, and laid him on the bed of the man of god, and
shut the door upon him, and went out.

4:22 and she call unto her husband, and said, send me, I pray thee,
on of the young men, and one of the asses, that I may run to the man
of god, and come again.

4:23 and he said, wherefor wilt thou go to him to day? it is neither
new moon, nor sabbath. and she said, It shall be well.

4:24 then she saddl an ass, and said to her servant, drive, and go
forward; slack not thi ride for me, except I bid thee.

4:25 So she went and came unto the man of god to mount carmel. and it
cam to pass, when the man of god saw her afar off, that he said to
gehazi hi servant, behold, yonder is that shunammite: 4:26 run now, i
pray thee, to meet her, and say unto her, Is it well with thee? is it
wel with thi husband? is it well with the child? and she answered, it
i well: 4:27 and when she came to the man of god to the hill, she
caught him by the feet: but gehazi came near to thrust her away. and
th man of god said, let her alone; for her soul is vex within her:
and the lord hath hid it from me, and hath not told me.

4:28 then she said, did I desir a son of my lord? did I not say, do
not deceiv me?  4:29 then he said to gehazi, gird up thi loins, and
tak my staff in thine hand, and go thi way: if thou meet ani man,
salut him not; and if ani salut thee, answer him not again: and lay
mi staff upon the face of the child.

4:30 and the mother of the child said, As the lord liveth, and as thy
soul liveth, I will not leav thee. and he arose, and follow her.

4:31 and gehazi pass on befor them, and laid the staff upon the
fac of the child; but there wa neither voice, nor hearing. wherefore
h went again to meet him, and told him, saying, the child is not
awaked.

4:32 and when elisha wa come into the house, behold, the child was
dead, and laid upon hi bed.

4:33 He went in therefore, and shut the door upon them twain, and
pray unto the lord.

4:34 and he went up, and lay upon the child, and put hi mouth upon
hi mouth, and hi eye upon hi eyes, and hi hand upon hi hands:
and stretch himself upon the child; and the flesh of the child waxed
warm.

4:35 then he returned, and walk in the hous to and fro; and went
up, and stretch himself upon him: and the child sneez seven times,
and the child open hi eyes.

4:36 and he call gehazi, and said, call thi shunammite. So he
cal her. and when she wa come in unto him, he said, take up thy
son.

4:37 then she went in, and fell at hi feet, and bow herself to the
ground, and took up her son, and went out.

4:38 and elisha came again to gilgal: and there wa a dearth in the
land; and the son of the prophet were sit befor him: and he
said unto hi servant, set on the great pot, and seeth pottag for
th son of the prophets.

4:39 and one went out into the field to gather herbs, and found a wild
vine, and gather thereof wild gourd hi lap full, and came and
shr them into the pot of pottage: for they knew them not.

4:40 So they pour out for the men to eat. and it came to pass, as
they were eat of the pottage, that they cri out, and said, O thou
man of god, there is death in the pot. and they could not eat thereof.

4:41 but he said, then bring meal. and he cast it into the pot; and he
said, pour out for the people, that they may eat. and there wa no
harm in the pot.

4:42 and there came a man from baalshalisha, and brought the man of
god bread of the firstfruits, twenti loav of barley, and full ears
of corn in the husk thereof. and he said, give unto the people, that
they may eat.

4:43 and hi servitor said, what, should I set thi befor an hundred
men?  He said again, give the people, that they may eat: for thus
saith the lord, they shall eat, and shall leav thereof.

4:44 So he set it befor them, and they did eat, and left thereof,
accord to the word of the lord.

5:1 now naaman, captain of the host of the king of syria, wa a great
man with hi master, and honourable, becaus by him the lord had given
deliver unto syria: he wa also a mighti man in valour, but he was
a leper.

5:2 and the syrian had gone out by companies, and had brought away
capt out of the land of israel a littl maid; and she wait on
naaman' wife.

5:3 and she said unto her mistress, would god my lord were with the
prophet that is in samaria! for he would recov him of hi leprosy.

5:4 and one went in, and told hi lord, saying, thu and thu said the
maid that is of the land of israel.

5:5 and the king of syria said, Go to, go, and I will send a letter
unto the king of israel. and he departed, and took with him ten
tal of silver, and six thousand piec of gold, and ten chang of
raiment.

5:6 and he brought the letter to the king of israel, saying, now when
thi letter is come unto thee, behold, I have therewith sent naaman my
serv to thee, that thou mayest recov him of hi leprosy.

5:7 and it came to pass, when the king of israel had read the letter,
that he rent hi clothes, and said, Am I god, to kill and to make
alive, that thi man doth send unto me to recov a man of his
leprosy? wherefor consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh a
quarrel against me.

5:8 and it wa so, when elisha the man of god had heard that the king
of israel had rent hi clothes, that he sent to the king, saying,
wherefor hast thou rent thi clothes? let him come now to me, and he
shal know that there is a prophet in israel.

5:9 So naaman came with hi hors and with hi chariot, and stood at
th door of the hous of elisha.

5:10 and elisha sent a messeng unto him, saying, Go and wash in
jordan seven times, and thi flesh shall come again to thee, and thou
shalt be clean.

5:11 but naaman wa wroth, and went away, and said, behold, I thought,
h will sure come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the
lord hi god, and strike hi hand over the place, and recov the
leper.

5:12 are not abana and pharpar, river of damascus, better than all
th water of israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean? So he
turn and went away in a rage.

5:13 and hi servant came near, and spake unto him, and said, my
father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou
not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee, wash,
and be clean?  5:14 then went he down, and dip himself seven times
in jordan, accord to the say of the man of god: and hi flesh
cam again like unto the flesh of a littl child, and he wa clean.

5:15 and he return to the man of god, he and all hi company, and
came, and stood befor him: and he said, behold, now I know that there
i no god in all the earth, but in israel: now therefore, I pray thee,
tak a bless of thi servant.

5:16 but he said, As the lord liveth, befor whom I stand, I will
rec none. and he urg him to take it; but he refused.

5:17 and naaman said, shall there not then, I pray thee, be given to
thi servant two mules' burden of earth? for thi servant will
henceforth offer neither burnt offer nor sacrific unto other gods,
but unto the lord.

5:18 In thi thing the lord pardon thi servant, that when my master
goeth into the hous of rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my
hand, and I bow myself in the hous of rimmon: when I bow down myself
in the hous of rimmon, the lord pardon thi servant in thi thing.

5:19 and he said unto him, Go in peace. So he depart from him a
littl way.

5:20 but gehazi, the servant of elisha the man of god, said, behold,
mi master hath spare naaman thi syrian, in not receiv at his
hand that which he brought: but, as the lord liveth, I will run after
him, and take somewhat of him.

5:21 So gehazi follow after naaman. and when naaman saw him running
aft him, he light down from the chariot to meet him, and said, is
al well?  5:22 and he said, all is well. My master hath sent me,
saying, behold, even now there be come to me from mount ephraim two
young men of the son of the prophets: give them, I pray thee, a
tal of silver, and two chang of garments.

5:23 and naaman said, Be content, take two talents. and he urg him,
and bound two talent of silver in two bags, with two chang of
garments, and laid them upon two of hi servants; and they bare them
befor him.

5:24 and when he came to the tower, he took them from their hand, and
bestow them in the house: and he let the men go, and they departed.

5:25 but he went in, and stood befor hi master. and elisha said unto
him, whenc comest thou, gehazi? and he said, thi servant went no
whither.

5:26 and he said unto him, went not mine heart with thee, when the man
turn again from hi chariot to meet thee? Is it a time to receive
money, and to receiv garments, and oliveyards, and vineyards, and
sheep, and oxen, and menservants, and maidservants?  5:27 the leprosy
therefor of naaman shall cleav unto thee, and unto thi seed for
ever. and he went out from hi presenc a leper as white as snow.

6:1 and the son of the prophet said unto elisha, behold now, the
plac where we dwell with thee is too strait for us.

6:2 let us go, we pray thee, unto jordan, and take thenc everi man a
beam, and let us make us a place there, where we may dwell. and he
answered, Go ye.

6:3 and one said, Be content, I pray thee, and go with thi servants.
and he answered, I will go.

6:4 So he went with them. and when they came to jordan, they cut down
wood.

6:5 but as one wa fell a beam, the axe head fell into the water:
and he cried, and said, alas, master! for it wa borrowed.

6:6 and the man of god said, where fell it? and he shew him the
place.

and he cut down a stick, and cast it in thither; and the iron did
swim.

6:7 therefor said he, take it up to thee. and he put out hi hand,
and took it.

6:8 then the king of syria war against israel, and took counsel
with hi servants, saying, In such and such a place shall be my camp.

6:9 and the man of god sent unto the king of israel, saying, beware
that thou pass not such a place; for thither the syrian are come
down.

6:10 and the king of israel sent to the place which the man of god
told him and warn him of, and save himself there, not onc nor
twice.

6:11 therefor the heart of the king of syria wa sore troubl for
thi thing; and he call hi servants, and said unto them, will ye
not shew me which of us is for the king of israel?  6:12 and one of
hi servant said, none, my lord, O king: but elisha, the prophet that
i in israel, telleth the king of israel the word that thou speakest
in thi bedchamber.

6:13 and he said, Go and spi where he is, that I may send and fetch
him.

and it wa told him, saying, behold, he is in dothan.

6:14 therefor sent he thither horses, and chariots, and a great host:
and they came by night, and compass the citi about.

6:15 and when the servant of the man of god wa risen early, and gone
forth, behold, an host compass the citi both with hors and
chariots. and hi servant said unto him, alas, my master! how shall we
do?  6:16 and he answered, fear not: for they that be with us are more
than they that be with them.

6:17 and elisha prayed, and said, lord, I pray thee, open hi eyes,
that he may see. and the lord open the eye of the young man; and he
saw: and, behold, the mountain wa full of hors and chariot of fire
round about elisha.

6:18 and when they came down to him, elisha pray unto the lord, and
said, smite thi people, I pray thee, with blindness. and he smote
them with blind accord to the word of elisha.

6:19 and elisha said unto them, thi is not the way, neither is this
th city: follow me, and I will bring you to the man whom ye seek. but
h led them to samaria.

6:20 and it came to pass, when they were come into samaria, that
elisha said, lord, open the eye of these men, that they may see. and
th lord open their eyes, and they saw; and, behold, they were in
th midst of samaria.

6:21 and the king of israel said unto elisha, when he saw them, my
father, shall I smite them? shall I smite them?  6:22 and he answered,
th shalt not smite them: wouldest thou smite those whom thou hast
taken captiv with thi sword and with thi bow? set bread and water
befor them, that they may eat and drink, and go to their master.

6:23 and he prepar great provis for them: and when they had eaten
and drunk, he sent them away, and they went to their master. So the
band of syria came no more into the land of israel.

6:24 and it came to pass after this, that benhadad king of syria
gath all hi host, and went up, and besieg samaria.

6:25 and there wa a great famin in samaria: and, behold, they
besieg it, until an ass' head wa sold for fourscor piec of
silver, and the fourth part of a cab of dove' dung for five piec of
silver.

6:26 and as the king of israel wa pass by upon the wall, there
cri a woman unto him, saying, help, my lord, O king.

6:27 and he said, If the lord do not help thee, whenc shall I help
thee?  out of the barnfloor, or out of the winepress?  6:28 and the
k said unto her, what aileth thee? and she answered, thi woman
said unto me, give thi son, that we may eat him to day, and we will
eat my son to morrow.

6:29 So we boil my son, and did eat him: and I said unto her on the
next day, give thi son, that we may eat him: and she hath hid her son.

6:30 and it came to pass, when the king heard the word of the woman,
that he rent hi clothes; and he pass by upon the wall, and the
peopl looked, and, behold, he had sackcloth within upon hi flesh.

6:31 then he said, god do so and more also to me, if the head of
elisha the son of shaphat shall stand on him thi day.

6:32 but elisha sat in hi house, and the elder sat with him; and the
k sent a man from befor him: but ere the messeng came to him, he
said to the elders, see ye how thi son of a murder hath sent to
tak away mine head? look, when the messeng cometh, shut the door,
and hold him fast at the door: is not the sound of hi master' feet
behind him?  6:33 and while he yet talk with them, behold, the
messeng came down unto him: and he said, behold, thi evil is of the
lord; what should I wait for the lord ani longer?  7:1 then elisha
said, hear ye the word of the lord; thu saith the lord, To morrow
about thi time shall a measur of fine flour be sold for a shekel,
and two measur of barley for a shekel, in the gate of samaria.

7:2 then a lord on whose hand the king lean answer the man of god,
and said, behold, if the lord would make window in heaven, might this
th be?  and he said, behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but
shalt not eat thereof.

7:3 and there were four leprou men at the enter in of the gate:
and they said one to another, whi sit we here until we die?  7:4 If we
say, We will enter into the city, then the famin is in the city, and
w shall die there: and if we sit still here, we die also. now
therefor come, and let us fall unto the host of the syrians: if they
sav us alive, we shall live; and if they kill us, we shall but die.

7:5 and they rose up in the twilight, to go unto the camp of the
syrians: and when they were come to the uttermost part of the camp of
syria, behold, there wa no man there.

7:6 for the lord had made the host of the syrian to hear a nois of
chariots, and a nois of horses, even the nois of a great host: and
they said one to another, lo, the king of israel hath hire against us
th king of the hittites, and the king of the egyptians, to come
upon us.

7:7 wherefor they aros and fled in the twilight, and left their
tents, and their horses, and their asses, even the camp as it was, and
fl for their life.

7:8 and when these leper came to the uttermost part of the camp, they
went into one tent, and did eat and drink, and carri thenc silver,
and gold, and raiment, and went and hid it; and came again, and
ent into anoth tent, and carri thenc also, and went and hid
it.

7:9 then they said one to another, We do not well: thi day is a day
of good tidings, and we hold our peace: if we tarri till the morning
light, some mischief will come upon us: now therefor come, that we
may go and tell the king' household.

7:10 So they came and call unto the porter of the city: and they
told them, saying, We came to the camp of the syrians, and, behold,
ther wa no man there, neither voic of man, but hors tied, and
ass tied, and the tent as they were.

7:11 and he call the porters; and they told it to the king' house
within.

7:12 and the king aros in the night, and said unto hi servants, i
wil now shew you what the syrian have done to us. they know that we
b hungry; therefor are they gone out of the camp to hide themselves
in the field, saying, when they come out of the city, we shall catch
them alive, and get into the city.

7:13 and one of hi servant answer and said, let some take, I pray
thee, five of the hors that remain, which are left in the city,
(behold, they are as all the multitud of israel that are left in it:
behold, I say, they are even as all the multitud of the israelites
that are consumed:) and let us send and see.

7:14 they took therefor two chariot horses; and the king sent after
th host of the syrians, saying, Go and see.

7:15 and they went after them unto jordan: and, lo, all the way was
ful of garment and vessels, which the syrian had cast away in their
haste. and the messeng returned, and told the king.

7:16 and the peopl went out, and spoil the tent of the syrians. so
a measur of fine flour wa sold for a shekel, and two measur of
barley for a shekel, accord to the word of the lord.

7:17 and the king appoint the lord on whose hand he lean to have
th charg of the gate: and the peopl trode upon him in the gate, and
h died, as the man of god had said, who spake when the king came down
to him.

7:18 and it came to pass as the man of god had spoken to the king,
saying, two measur of barley for a shekel, and a measur of fine
flour for a shekel, shall be to morrow about thi time in the gate of
samaria: 7:19 and that lord answer the man of god, and said, now,
behold, if the lord should make window in heaven, might such a thing
be? and he said, behold, thou shalt see it with thine eyes, but shalt
not eat thereof.

7:20 and so it fell out unto him: for the peopl trode upon him in the
gate, and he died.

8:1 then spake elisha unto the woman, whose son he had restor to
life, saying, arise, and go thou and thine household, and sojourn
wheresoev thou canst sojourn: for the lord hath call for a famine;
and it shall also come upon the land seven years.

8:2 and the woman arose, and did after the say of the man of god:
and she went with her household, and sojourn in the land of the
philistin seven years.

8:3 and it came to pass at the seven years' end, that the woman
return out of the land of the philistines: and she went forth to cry
unto the king for her hous and for her land.

8:4 and the king talk with gehazi the servant of the man of god,
saying, tell me, I pray thee, all the great thing that elisha hath
done.

8:5 and it came to pass, as he wa tell the king how he had
restor a dead bodi to life, that, behold, the woman, whose son he
had restor to life, cri to the king for her hous and for her
land. and gehazi said, My lord, O king, thi is the woman, and thi is
her son, whom elisha restor to life.

8:6 and when the king ask the woman, she told him. So the king
appoint unto her a certain officer, saying, restor all that was
hers, and all the fruit of the field sinc the day that she left the
land, even until now.

8:7 and elisha came to damascus; and benhadad the king of syria was
sick; and it wa told him, saying, the man of god is come hither.

8:8 and the king said unto hazael, take a present in thine hand, and
go, meet the man of god, and enquir of the lord by him, saying, shall
i recov of thi disease?  8:9 So hazael went to meet him, and took a
pres with him, even of everi good thing of damascus, forti camels'
burden, and came and stood befor him, and said, thi son benhadad king
of syria hath sent me to thee, saying, shall I recov of this
disease?  8:10 and elisha said unto him, go, say unto him, thou mayest
certainli recover: howbeit the lord hath shew me that he shall
sur die.
