8:11 and he settl hi counten stedfastly, until he wa ashamed:
and the man of god wept.

8:12 and hazael said, whi weepeth my lord? and he answered, becaus i
know the evil that thou wilt do unto the children of israel: their
strong hold wilt thou set on fire, and their young men wilt thou slay
with the sword, and wilt dash their children, and rip up their women
with child.

8:13 and hazael said, but what, is thi servant a dog, that he should
do thi great thing? and elisha answered, the lord hath shew me that
thou shalt be king over syria.

8:14 So he depart from elisha, and came to hi master; who said to
him, what said elisha to thee? and he answered, He told me that thou
shouldest sure recover.

8:15 and it came to pass on the morrow, that he took a thick cloth,
and dip it in water, and spread it on hi face, so that he died:
and hazael reign in hi stead.

8:16 and in the fifth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel,
jehoshaphat be then king of judah, jehoram the son of Je hoshaphat
k of judah began to reign.

8:17 thirti and two year old wa he when he began to reign; and he
reign eight year in jerusalem.

8:18 and he walk in the way of the king of israel, as did the house
of ahab: for the daughter of ahab wa hi wife: and he did evil in the
sight of the lord.

8:19 yet the lord would not destroy judah for david hi servant's
sake, as he promis him to give him alway a light, and to his
children.

8:20 In hi day edom revolt from under the hand of judah, and made
a king over themselves.

8:21 So joram went over to zair, and all the chariot with him: and he
ros by night, and smote the edomit which compass him about, and
th captain of the chariots: and the peopl fled into their tents.

8:22 yet edom revolt from under the hand of judah unto thi day.
then libnah revolt at the same time.

8:23 and the rest of the act of joram, and all that he did, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?  8:24
and joram slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with hi father in
th citi of david: and ahaziah hi son reign in hi stead.

8:25 In the twelfth year of joram the son of ahab king of israel did
ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah begin to reign.

8:26 two and twenti year old wa ahaziah when he began to reign; and
h reign one year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name wa athaliah,
th daughter of omri king of israel.

8:27 and he walk in the way of the hous of ahab, and did evil in
th sight of the lord, as did the hous of ahab: for he wa the son in
law of the hous of ahab.

8:28 and he went with joram the son of ahab to the war against hazael
k of syria in ramothgilead; and the syrian wound joram.

8:29 and king joram went back to be heal in jezreel of the wounds
which the syrian had given him at ramah, when he fought against
hazael king of syria. and ahaziah the son of jehoram king of judah
w down to see joram the son of ahab in jezreel, becaus he was
sick.

9:1 and elisha the prophet call one of the children of the prophets,
and said unto him, gird up thi loins, and take thi box of oil in
thin hand, and go to ramothgilead: 9:2 and when thou comest thither,
look out there jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi, and go
in, and make him aris up from among hi brethren, and carri him to an
inn chamber; 9:3 then take the box of oil, and pour it on hi head,
and say, thu saith the lord, I have anoint thee king over israel.
then open the door, and flee, and tarri not.

9:4 So the young man, even the young man the prophet, went to
ramothgilead.

9:5 and when he came, behold, the captain of the host were sitting;
and he said, I have an errand to thee, O captain. and jehu said, unto
which of all us? and he said, To thee, O captain.

9:6 and he arose, and went into the house; and he pour the oil on
hi head, and said unto him, thu saith the lord god of israel, I have
anoint thee king over the peopl of the lord, even over israel.

9:7 and thou shalt smite the hous of ahab thi master, that I may
aveng the blood of my servant the prophets, and the blood of all the
serv of the lord, at the hand of jezebel.

9:8 for the whole hous of ahab shall perish: and I will cut off from
ahab him that pisseth against the wall, and him that is shut up and
left in israel: 9:9 and I will make the hous of ahab like the house
of jeroboam the son of nebat, and like the hous of baasha the son of
ahijah: 9:10 and the dog shall eat jezebel in the portion of jezreel,
and there shall be none to buri her. and he open the door, and fled.

9:11 then jehu came forth to the servant of hi lord: and one said
unto him, Is all well? wherefor came thi mad fellow to thee? and he
said unto them, Ye know the man, and hi communication.

9:12 and they said, It is false; tell us now. and he said, thu and
thu spake he to me, saying, thu saith the lord, I have anoint thee
k over israel.

9:13 then they hasted, and took everi man hi garment, and put it
und him on the top of the stairs, and blew with trumpets, saying,
jehu is king.

9:14 So jehu the son of jehoshaphat the son of nimshi conspired
against joram. (now joram had kept ramothgilead, he and all israel,
becaus of hazael king of syria.

9:15 but king joram wa return to be heal in jezreel of the wounds
which the syrian had given him, when he fought with hazael king of
syria.)  and jehu said, If it be your minds, then let none go forth
nor escap out of the citi to go to tell it in jezreel.

9:16 So jehu rode in a chariot, and went to jezreel; for joram lay
there.

and ahaziah king of judah wa come down to see joram.

9:17 and there stood a watchman on the tower in jezreel, and he spied
th compani of jehu as he came, and said, I see a company. and joram
said, take an horseman, and send to meet them, and let him say, Is it
peace?  9:18 So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said,
thu saith the king, Is it peace? and jehu said, what hast thou to do
with peace? turn thee behind me. and the watchman told, saying, the
messeng came to them, but he cometh not again.

9:19 then he sent out a second on horseback, which came to them, and
said, thu saith the king, Is it peace? and jehu answered, what hast
thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.

9:20 and the watchman told, saying, He came even unto them, and cometh
not again: and the drive is like the drive of jehu the son of
nimshi; for he driveth furiously.

9:21 and joram said, make ready. and hi chariot wa made ready. and
joram king of israel and ahaziah king of judah went out, each in his
chariot, and they went out against jehu, and met him in the portion of
naboth the jezreelite.

9:22 and it came to pass, when joram saw jehu, that he said, Is it
peace, jehu? and he answered, what peace, so long as the whoredom of
thi mother jezebel and her witchcraft are so many?  9:23 and joram
turn hi hands, and fled, and said to ahaziah, there is treachery, o
ahaziah.

9:24 and jehu drew a bow with hi full strength, and smote jehoram
between hi arms, and the arrow went out at hi heart, and he sunk
down in hi chariot.

9:25 then said jehu to bidkar hi captain, take up, and cast him in
th portion of the field of naboth the jezreelite: for rememb how
that, when I and thou rode togeth after ahab hi father, the lord
laid thi burden upon him; 9:26 sure I have seen yesterday the blood
of naboth, and the blood of hi sons, saith the lord; and I will
requit thee in thi plat, saith the lord. now therefor take and cast
him into the plat of ground, accord to the word of the lord.

9:27 but when ahaziah the king of judah saw this, he fled by the way
of the garden house. and jehu follow after him, and said, smite him
also in the chariot. and they did so at the go up to gur, which is
bi ibleam.

and he fled to megiddo, and die there.

9:28 and hi servant carri him in a chariot to jerusalem, and
buri him in hi sepulchr with hi father in the citi of david.

9:29 and in the eleventh year of joram the son of ahab began ahaziah
to reign over judah.

9:30 and when jehu wa come to jezreel, jezebel heard of it; and she
paint her face, and tire her head, and look out at a window.

9:31 and as jehu enter in at the gate, she said, had zimri peace,
who slew hi master?  9:32 and he lift up hi face to the window,
and said, who is on my side?  who? and there look out to him two or
thre eunuchs.

9:33 and he said, throw her down. So they threw her down: and some of
her blood wa sprinkl on the wall, and on the horses: and he trode
h under foot.

9:34 and when he wa come in, he did eat and drink, and said, go, see
now thi curs woman, and buri her: for she is a king' daughter.

9:35 and they went to buri her: but they found no more of her than the
skull, and the feet, and the palm of her hands.

9:36 wherefor they came again, and told him. and he said, thi is the
word of the lord, which he spake by hi servant elijah the tishbite,
saying, In the portion of jezreel shall dog eat the flesh of jezebel:
9:37 and the carcas of jezebel shall be as dung upon the face of the
field in the portion of jezreel; so that they shall not say, thi is
jezebel.

10:1 and ahab had seventi son in samaria. and jehu wrote letters, and
sent to samaria, unto the ruler of jezreel, to the elders, and to
them that brought up ahab' children, saying, 10:2 now as soon as this
lett cometh to you, see your master' son are with you, and
ther are with you chariot and horses, a fenc citi also, and
armour; 10:3 look even out the best and meetest of your master' sons,
and set him on hi father' throne, and fight for your master' house.

10:4 but they were exceedingli afraid, and said, behold, two kings
stood not befor him: how then shall we stand?  10:5 and he that was
ov the house, and he that wa over the city, the elder also, and
th bringer up of the children, sent to jehu, saying, We are thy
servants, and will do all that thou shalt bid us; we will not make any
king: do thou that which is good in thine eyes.

10:6 then he wrote a letter the second time to them, saying, If ye be
mine, and if ye will hearken unto my voice, take ye the head of the
men your master' sons, and come to me to jezreel by to morrow this
time. now the king' sons, be seventi persons, were with the great
men of the city, which brought them up.

10:7 and it came to pass, when the letter came to them, that they took
th king' sons, and slew seventi persons, and put their head in
baskets, and sent him them to jezreel.

10:8 and there came a messenger, and told him, saying, they have
brought the head of the king' sons. and he said, lay ye them in two
heap at the enter in of the gate until the morning.

10:9 and it came to pass in the morning, that he went out, and stood,
and said to all the people, Ye be righteous: behold, I conspired
against my master, and slew him: but who slew all these?  10:10 know
now that there shall fall unto the earth noth of the word of the
lord, which the lord spake concern the hous of ahab: for the lord
hath done that which he spake by hi servant elijah.

10:11 So jehu slew all that remain of the hous of ahab in jezreel,
and all hi great men, and hi kinsfolks, and hi priests, until he
left him none remaining.

10:12 and he aros and departed, and came to samaria. and as he wa at
th shear hous in the way, 10:13 jehu met with the brethren of
ahaziah king of judah, and said, who are ye? and they answered, We are
th brethren of ahaziah; and we go down to salut the children of the
k and the children of the queen.

10:14 and he said, take them alive. and they took them alive, and slew
them at the pit of the shear house, even two and forti men; neither
left he ani of them.

10:15 and when he wa depart thence, he light on jehonadab the son
of rechab come to meet him: and he salut him, and said to him, is
thin heart right, as my heart is with thi heart? and jehonadab
answered, It is. If it be, give me thine hand. and he gave him his
hand; and he took him up to him into the chariot.

10:16 and he said, come with me, and see my zeal for the lord. So they
mad him ride in hi chariot.

10:17 and when he came to samaria, he slew all that remain unto ahab
in samaria, till he had destroy him, accord to the say of the
lord, which he spake to elijah.

10:18 and jehu gather all the peopl together, and said unto them,
ahab serv baal a little; but jehu shall serv him much.

10:19 now therefor call unto me all the prophet of baal, all his
servants, and all hi priests; let none be wanting: for I have a great
sacrific to do to baal; whosoev shall be wanting, he shall not
live. but jehu did it in subtilty, to the intent that he might destroy
th worshipp of baal.

10:20 and jehu said, proclaim a solemn assembl for baal. and they
proclaim it.

10:21 and jehu sent through all israel: and all the worshipp of
baal came, so that there wa not a man left that came not. and they
cam into the hous of baal; and the hous of baal wa full from one
end to another.

10:22 and he said unto him that wa over the vestry, bring forth
vest for all the worshipp of baal. and he brought them forth
vestments.

10:23 and jehu went, and jehonadab the son of rechab, into the house
of baal, and said unto the worshipp of baal, search, and look that
ther be here with you none of the servant of the lord, but the
worshipp of baal only.

10:24 and when they went in to offer sacrific and burnt offerings,
jehu appoint fourscor men without, and said, If ani of the men whom
i have brought into your hand escape, he that letteth him go, his
lif shall be for the life of him.

10:25 and it came to pass, as soon as he had made an end of offering
th burnt offering, that jehu said to the guard and to the captains,
go in, and slay them; let none come forth. and they smote them with
th edg of the sword; and the guard and the captain cast them out,
and went to the citi of the hous of baal.

10:26 and they brought forth the imag out of the hous of baal, and
burn them.

10:27 and they brake down the imag of baal, and brake down the house
of baal, and made it a draught hous unto thi day.

10:28 thu jehu destroy baal out of israel.

10:29 howbeit from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, who made
israel to sin, jehu depart not from after them, to wit, the golden
calv that were in bethel, and that were in dan.

10:30 and the lord said unto jehu, becaus thou hast done well in
execut that which is right in mine eyes, and hast done unto the
hous of ahab accord to all that wa in mine heart, thi children of
th fourth gener shall sit on the throne of israel.

10:31 but jehu took no heed to walk in the law of the lord god of
israel with all hi heart: for he depart not from the sin of
jeroboam, which made israel to sin.

10:32 In those day the lord began to cut israel short: and hazael
smot them in all the coast of israel; 10:33 from jordan eastward,
al the land of gilead, the gadites, and the reubenites, and the
manassites, from aroer, which is by the river arnon, even gilead and
bashan.

10:34 now the rest of the act of jehu, and all that he did, and all
hi might, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
k of israel?  10:35 and jehu slept with hi fathers: and they
buri him in samaria. and jehoahaz hi son reign in hi stead.

10:36 and the time that jehu reign over israel in samaria wa twenty
and eight years.

11:1 and when athaliah the mother of ahaziah saw that her son was
dead, she aros and destroy all the seed royal.

11:2 but jehosheba, the daughter of king joram, sister of ahaziah,
took joash the son of ahaziah, and stole him from among the king's
son which were slain; and they hid him, even him and hi nurse, in
th bedchamb from athaliah, so that he wa not slain.

11:3 and he wa with her hid in the hous of the lord six years. and
athaliah did reign over the land.

11:4 and the seventh year jehoiada sent and fetch the ruler over
hundreds, with the captain and the guard, and brought them to him
into the hous of the lord, and made a coven with them, and took an
oath of them in the hous of the lord, and shew them the king' son.

11:5 and he command them, saying, thi is the thing that ye shall
do; A third part of you that enter in on the sabbath shall even be
keep of the watch of the king' house; 11:6 and a third part shall
b at the gate of sur; and a third part at the gate behind the guard:
so shall ye keep the watch of the house, that it be not broken down.

11:7 and two part of all you that go forth on the sabbath, even they
shal keep the watch of the hous of the lord about the king.

11:8 and ye shall compass the king round about, everi man with his
weapon in hi hand: and he that cometh within the ranges, let him be
slain: and be ye with the king as he goeth out and as he cometh in.

11:9 and the captain over the hundr did accord to all things
that jehoiada the priest commanded: and they took everi man hi men
that were to come in on the sabbath, with them that should go out on
th sabbath, and came to jehoiada the priest.

11:10 and to the captain over hundr did the priest give king
david' spear and shields, that were in the templ of the lord.

11:11 and the guard stood, everi man with hi weapon in hi hand,
round about the king, from the right corner of the templ to the left
corn of the temple, along by the altar and the temple.

11:12 and he brought forth the king' son, and put the crown upon him,
and gave him the testimony; and they made him king, and anoint him;
and they clap their hands, and said, god save the king.

11:13 and when athaliah heard the nois of the guard and of the
people, she came to the peopl into the templ of the lord.

11:14 and when she looked, behold, the king stood by a pillar, as the
mann was, and the princ and the trumpet by the king, and all
th peopl of the land rejoiced, and blew with trumpets: and athaliah
r her clothes, and cried, treason, treason.

11:15 but jehoiada the priest command the captain of the hundreds,
th offic of the host, and said unto them, have her forth without
th ranges: and him that followeth her kill with the sword. for the
priest had said, let her not be slain in the hous of the lord.

11:16 and they laid hand on her; and she went by the way by the which
th hors came into the king' house: and there wa she slain.

11:17 and jehoiada made a coven between the lord and the king and
th people, that they should be the lord' people; between the king
also and the people.

11:18 and all the peopl of the land went into the hous of baal, and
brak it down; hi altar and hi imag brake they in pieces
thoroughly, and slew mattan the priest of baal befor the altars. and
th priest appoint offic over the hous of the lord.

11:19 and he took the ruler over hundreds, and the captains, and the
guard, and all the peopl of the land; and they brought down the king
from the hous of the lord, and came by the way of the gate of the
guard to the king' house. and he sat on the throne of the kings.

11:20 and all the peopl of the land rejoiced, and the citi wa in
quiet: and they slew athaliah with the sword besid the king' house.

11:21 seven year old wa jehoash when he began to reign.

12:1 In the seventh year of jehu jehoash began to reign; and forty
year reign he in jerusalem. and hi mother' name wa zibiah of
beersheba.

12:2 and jehoash did that which wa right in the sight of the lord all
hi day wherein jehoiada the priest instruct him.

12:3 but the high place were not taken away: the peopl still
sacrif and burnt incens in the high places.

12:4 and jehoash said to the priests, all the money of the dedicated
th that is brought into the hous of the lord, even the money of
everi one that passeth the account, the money that everi man is set
at, and all the money that cometh into ani man' heart to bring into
th hous of the lord, 12:5 let the priest take it to them, everi man
of hi acquaintance: and let them repair the breach of the house,
wheresoev ani breach shall be found.

12:6 but it wa so, that in the three and twentieth year of king
jehoash the priest had not repair the breach of the house.

12:7 then king jehoash call for jehoiada the priest, and the other
priests, and said unto them, whi repair ye not the breach of the
house? now therefor receiv no more money of your acquaintance, but
deliv it for the breach of the house.

12:8 and the priest consent to receiv no more money of the people,
neith to repair the breach of the house.

12:9 but jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bore a hole in the lid
of it, and set it besid the altar, on the right side as one cometh
into the hous of the lord: and the priest that kept the door put
therein all the money that wa brought into the hous of the lord.

12:10 and it wa so, when they saw that there wa much money in the
chest, that the king' scribe and the high priest came up, and they
put up in bags, and told the money that wa found in the hous of the
lord.

12:11 and they gave the money, be told, into the hand of them that
did the work, that had the oversight of the hous of the lord: and
they laid it out to the carpent and builders, that wrought upon the
hous of the lord, 12:12 and to masons, and hewer of stone, and to
buy timber and hew stone to repair the breach of the hous of the
lord, and for all that wa laid out for the hous to repair it.

12:13 howbeit there were not made for the hous of the lord bowl of
silver, snuffers, basons, trumpets, ani vessel of gold, or vessel of
silver, of the money that wa brought into the hous of the lord:
12:14 but they gave that to the workmen, and repair therewith the
hous of the lord.

12:15 moreov they reckon not with the men, into whose hand they
deliv the money to be bestow on workmen: for they dealt
faithfully.

12:16 the trespass money and sin money wa not brought into the house
of the lord: it wa the priests'.

12:17 then hazael king of syria went up, and fought against gath, and
took it: and hazael set hi face to go up to jerusalem.

12:18 and jehoash king of judah took all the hallow thing that
jehoshaphat, and jehoram, and ahaziah, hi fathers, king of judah,
had dedicated, and hi own hallow things, and all the gold that was
found in the treasur of the hous of the lord, and in the king's
house, and sent it to hazael king of syria: and he went away from
jerusalem.

12:19 and the rest of the act of joash, and all that he did, are they
not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
12:20 and hi servant arose, and made a conspiracy, and slew joash in
th hous of millo, which goeth down to silla.

12:21 for jozachar the son of shimeath, and jehozabad the son of
shomer, hi servants, smote him, and he died; and they buri him with
hi father in the citi of david: and amaziah hi son reign in his
stead.

13:1 In the three and twentieth year of joash the son of ahaziah king
of judah jehoahaz the son of jehu began to reign over israel in
samaria, and reign seventeen years.

13:2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, and
follow the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, which made israel to
sin; he depart not therefrom.

13:3 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against israel, and he
deliv them into the hand of hazael king of syria, and into the
hand of benhadad the son of hazael, all their days.

13:4 and jehoahaz besought the lord, and the lord hearken unto him:
for he saw the oppress of israel, becaus the king of syria
oppress them.

13:5 (and the lord gave israel a saviour, so that they went out from
und the hand of the syrians: and the children of israel dwelt in
their tents, as beforetime.

13:6 nevertheless they depart not from the sin of the hous of
jeroboam, who made israel sin, but walk therein: and there remained
th grove also in samaria.)  13:7 neither did he leav of the people
to jehoahaz but fifti horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand
footmen; for the king of syria had destroy them, and had made them
lik the dust by threshing.

13:8 now the rest of the act of jehoahaz, and all that he did, and
hi might, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the
k of israel?  13:9 and jehoahaz slept with hi fathers; and they
buri him in samaria: and joash hi son reign in hi stead.

13:10 In the thirti and seventh year of joash king of judah began
jehoash the son of jehoahaz to reign over israel in samaria, and
reign sixteen years.

13:11 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord; he
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, who made
israel sin: but he walk therein.

13:12 and the rest of the act of joash, and all that he did, and his
might wherewith he fought against amaziah king of judah, are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?  13:13
and joash slept with hi fathers; and jeroboam sat upon hi throne:
and joash wa buri in samaria with the king of israel.

13:14 now elisha wa fallen sick of hi sick whereof he died. and
joash the king of israel came down unto him, and wept over hi face,
and said, O my father, my father, the chariot of israel, and the
horsemen thereof.

13:15 and elisha said unto him, take bow and arrows. and he took unto
him bow and arrows.

13:16 and he said to the king of israel, put thine hand upon the bow.
and he put hi hand upon it: and elisha put hi hand upon the king's
hands.

13:17 and he said, open the window eastward. and he open it. then
elisha said, shoot. and he shot. and he said, the arrow of the lord's
deliverance, and the arrow of deliver from syria: for thou shalt
smit the syrian in aphek, till thou have consum them.

13:18 and he said, take the arrows. and he took them. and he said unto
th king of israel, smite upon the ground. and he smote thrice, and
stayed.

13:19 and the man of god wa wroth with him, and said, thou shouldest
hav smitten five or six times; then hadst thou smitten syria till
thou hadst consum it: wherea now thou shalt smite syria but thrice.

13:20 and elisha died, and they buri him. and the band of the
moabit invad the land at the come in of the year.

13:21 and it came to pass, as they were buri a man, that, behold,
they spi a band of men; and they cast the man into the sepulchr of
elisha: and when the man wa let down, and touch the bone of
elisha, he revived, and stood up on hi feet.

13:22 but hazael king of syria oppress israel all the day of
jehoahaz.

13:23 and the lord wa graciou unto them, and had compass on them,
and had respect unto them, becaus of hi coven with abraham,
isaac, and jacob, and would not destroy them, neither cast he them
from hi presenc as yet.

13:24 So hazael king of syria died; and benhadad hi son reign in
hi stead.

13:25 and jehoash the son of jehoahaz took again out of the hand of
benhadad the son of hazael the cities, which he had taken out of the
hand of jehoahaz hi father by war. three time did joash beat him,
and recov the citi of israel.

14:1 In the second year of joash son of jehoahaz king of israel
reign amaziah the son of joash king of judah.

14:2 He wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign, and
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
jehoaddan of jerusalem.

14:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord, yet not
lik david hi father: he did accord to all thing as joash his
fath did.

14:4 howbeit the high place were not taken away: as yet the people
did sacrific and burnt incens on the high places.

14:5 and it came to pass, as soon as the kingdom wa confirm in his
hand, that he slew hi servant which had slain the king hi father.

14:6 but the children of the murder he slew not: accord unto
that which is written in the book of the law of moses, wherein the
lord commanded, saying, the father shall not be put to death for the
children, nor the children be put to death for the fathers; but every
man shall be put to death for hi own sin.

14:7 He slew of edom in the valley of salt ten thousand, and took
selah by war, and call the name of it joktheel unto thi day.

14:8 then amaziah sent messeng to jehoash, the son of jehoahaz son
of jehu, king of israel, saying, come, let us look one anoth in the
face.

14:9 and jehoash the king of israel sent to amaziah king of judah,
saying, the thistl that wa in lebanon sent to the cedar that wa in
lebanon, saying, give thi daughter to my son to wife: and there passed
bi a wild beast that wa in lebanon, and trode down the thistle.

14:10 thou hast inde smitten edom, and thine heart hath lift thee
up: glori of this, and tarri at home: for whi shouldest thou meddl to
thi hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and judah with thee?
14:11 but amaziah would not hear. therefor jehoash king of israel
w up; and he and amaziah king of judah look one anoth in the
fac at bethshemesh, which belongeth to judah.

14:12 and judah wa put to the wors befor israel; and they fled
everi man to their tents.

14:13 and jehoash king of israel took amaziah king of judah, the son
of jehoash the son of ahaziah, at bethshemesh, and came to jerusalem,
and brake down the wall of jerusalem from the gate of ephraim unto the
corn gate, four hundr cubits.

14:14 and he took all the gold and silver, and all the vessel that
wer found in the hous of the lord, and in the treasur of the
king' house, and hostages, and return to samaria.

14:15 now the rest of the act of jehoash which he did, and hi might,
and how he fought with amaziah king of judah, are they not written in
th book of the chronicl of the king of israel?  14:16 and jehoash
slept with hi fathers, and wa buri in samaria with the king of
israel; and jeroboam hi son reign in hi stead.

14:17 and amaziah the son of joash king of judah live after the death
of jehoash son of jehoahaz king of israel fifteen years.

14:18 and the rest of the act of amaziah, are they not written in the
book of the chronicl of the king of judah?  14:19 now they made a
conspiraci against him in jerusalem: and he fled to lachish; but they
sent after him to lachish, and slew him there.

14:20 and they brought him on horses: and he wa buri at jerusalem
with hi father in the citi of david.

14:21 and all the peopl of judah took azariah, which wa sixteen
year old, and made him king instead of hi father amaziah.

14:22 He built elath, and restor it to judah, after that the king
slept with hi fathers.

14:23 In the fifteenth year of amaziah the son of joash king of judah
jeroboam the son of joash king of israel began to reign in samaria,
and reign forti and one years.

14:24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from all the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, who made
israel to sin.

14:25 He restor the coast of israel from the enter of hamath unto
th sea of the plain, accord to the word of the lord god of israel,
which he spake by the hand of hi servant jonah, the son of amittai,
th prophet, which wa of gathhepher.

14:26 for the lord saw the afflict of israel, that it wa very
bitter: for there wa not ani shut up, nor ani left, nor ani helper
for israel.

14:27 and the lord said not that he would blot out the name of israel
from under heaven: but he save them by the hand of jeroboam the son
of joash.

14:28 now the rest of the act of jeroboam, and all that he did, and
hi might, how he warred, and how he recov damascus, and hamath,
which belong to judah, for israel, are they not written in the book
of the chronicl of the king of israel?  14:29 and jeroboam slept
with hi fathers, even with the king of israel; and zachariah hi son
reign in hi stead.

15:1 In the twenti and seventh year of jeroboam king of israel began
azariah son of amaziah king of judah to reign.

15:2 sixteen year old wa he when he began to reign, and he reigned
two and fifti year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name wa jecholiah
of jerusalem.

15:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father amaziah had done; 15:4 save that the
high place were not removed: the peopl sacrif and burnt incense
stil on the high places.

15:5 and the lord smote the king, so that he wa a leper unto the day
of hi death, and dwelt in a sever house. and jotham the king' son
wa over the house, judg the peopl of the land.

15:6 and the rest of the act of azariah, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
15:7 So azariah slept with hi fathers; and they buri him with his
fath in the citi of david: and jotham hi son reign in hi stead.

15:8 In the thirti and eighth year of azariah king of judah did
zachariah the son of jeroboam reign over israel in samaria six months.

15:9 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, as his
fath had done: he depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of
nebat, who made israel to sin.

15:10 and shallum the son of jabesh conspir against him, and smote
him befor the people, and slew him, and reign in hi stead.

15:11 and the rest of the act of zachariah, behold, they are written
in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel.

15:12 thi wa the word of the lord which he spake unto jehu, saying,
thi son shall sit on the throne of israel unto the fourth generation.
and so it came to pass.

15:13 shallum the son of jabesh began to reign in the nine and
thirtieth year of uzziah king of judah; and he reign a full month in
samaria.

15:14 for menahem the son of gadi went up from tirzah, and came to
samaria, and smote shallum the son of jabesh in samaria, and slew him,
and reign in hi stead.

15:15 and the rest of the act of shallum, and hi conspiraci which he
made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicl of the
k of israel.

15:16 then menahem smote tiphsah, and all that were therein, and the
coast thereof from tirzah: becaus they open not to him, therefore
h smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped
up.

15:17 In the nine and thirtieth year of azariah king of judah began
menahem the son of gadi to reign over israel, and reign ten year in
samaria.

15:18 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not all hi day from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat,
who made israel to sin.

15:19 and pul the king of assyria came against the land: and menahem
gav pul a thousand talent of silver, that hi hand might be with him
to confirm the kingdom in hi hand.

15:20 and menahem exact the money of israel, even of all the mighty
men of wealth, of each man fifti shekel of silver, to give to the
k of assyria. So the king of assyria turn back, and stay not
ther in the land.

15:21 and the rest of the act of menahem, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel?
15:22 and menahem slept with hi fathers; and pekahiah hi son reigned
in hi stead.

15:23 In the fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekahiah the son
of menahem began to reign over israel in samaria, and reign two
years.

15:24 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, who made
israel to sin.

15:25 but pekah the son of remaliah, a captain of his, conspired
against him, and smote him in samaria, in the palac of the king's
house, with argob and arieh, and with him fifti men of the gileadites:
and he kill him, and reign in hi room.

15:26 and the rest of the act of pekahiah, and all that he did,
behold, they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of
israel.

15:27 In the two and fiftieth year of azariah king of judah pekah the
son of remaliah began to reign over israel in samaria, and reigned
twenti years.

15:28 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord: he
depart not from the sin of jeroboam the son of nebat, who made
israel to sin.

15:29 In the day of pekah king of israel came tiglathpiles king of
assyria, and took ijon, and abelbethmaachah, and janoah, and kedesh,
and hazor, and gilead, and galilee, all the land of naphtali, and
carri them captiv to assyria.

15:30 and hoshea the son of elah made a conspiraci against pekah the
son of remaliah, and smote him, and slew him, and reign in his
stead, in the twentieth year of jotham the son of uzziah.

15:31 and the rest of the act of pekah, and all that he did, behold,
they are written in the book of the chronicl of the king of israel.

15:32 In the second year of pekah the son of remaliah king of israel
began jotham the son of uzziah king of judah to reign.

15:33 five and twenti year old wa he when he began to reign, and he
reign sixteen year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name wa jerusha,
th daughter of zadok.

15:34 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord: he did
accord to all that hi father uzziah had done.

15:35 howbeit the high place were not removed: the peopl sacrificed
and burn incens still in the high places. He built the higher gate
of the hous of the lord.

15:36 now the rest of the act of jotham, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
15:37 In those day the lord began to send against judah rezin the
k of syria, and pekah the son of remaliah.

15:38 and jotham slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with his
fath in the citi of david hi father: and ahaz hi son reign in
hi stead.

16:1 In the seventeenth year of pekah the son of remaliah ahaz the son
of jotham king of judah began to reign.

16:2 twenti year old wa ahaz when he began to reign, and reigned
sixteen year in jerusalem, and did not that which wa right in the
sight of the lord hi god, like david hi father.

16:3 but he walk in the way of the king of israel, yea, and made
hi son to pass through the fire, accord to the abomin of the
heathen, whom the lord cast out from befor the children of israel.

16:4 and he sacrif and burnt incens in the high places, and on
th hills, and under everi green tree.

16:5 then rezin king of syria and pekah son of remaliah king of israel
cam up to jerusalem to war: and they besieg ahaz, but could not
overcom him.

16:6 At that time rezin king of syria recov elath to syria, and
drav the jew from elath: and the syrian came to elath, and dwelt
ther unto thi day.

16:7 So ahaz sent messeng to tiglathpiles king of assyria,
saying, I am thi servant and thi son: come up, and save me out of the
hand of the king of syria, and out of the hand of the king of israel,
which rise up against me.

16:8 and ahaz took the silver and gold that wa found in the hous of
th lord, and in the treasur of the king' house, and sent it for a
pres to the king of assyria.

16:9 and the king of assyria hearken unto him: for the king of
assyria went up against damascus, and took it, and carri the people
of it captiv to kir, and slew rezin.

16:10 and king ahaz went to damascu to meet tiglathpiles king of
assyria, and saw an altar that wa at damascus: and king ahaz sent to
urijah the priest the fashion of the altar, and the pattern of it,
accord to all the workmanship thereof.

16:11 and urijah the priest built an altar accord to all that king
ahaz had sent from damascus: so urijah the priest made it against king
ahaz came from damascus.

16:12 and when the king wa come from damascus, the king saw the
altar: and the king approach to the altar, and offer thereon.

16:13 and he burnt hi burnt offer and hi meat offering, and
pour hi drink offering, and sprinkl the blood of hi peace
offerings, upon the altar.

16:14 and he brought also the brasen altar, which wa befor the lord,
from the forefront of the house, from between the altar and the house
of the lord, and put it on the north side of the altar.

16:15 and king ahaz command urijah the priest, saying, upon the
great altar burn the morn burnt offering, and the even meat
offering, and the king' burnt sacrifice, and hi meat offering, with
th burnt offer of all the peopl of the land, and their meat
offering, and their drink offerings; and sprinkl upon it all the
blood of the burnt offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice: and
th brasen altar shall be for me to enquir by.

16:16 thu did urijah the priest, accord to all that king ahaz
commanded.

16:17 and king ahaz cut off the border of the bases, and remov the
lav from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen
that were under it, and put it upon the pavement of stones.

16:18 and the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the house,
and the king' entri without, turn he from the hous of the lord for
th king of assyria.

16:19 now the rest of the act of ahaz which he did, are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?  16:20
and ahaz slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with hi father in
th citi of david: and hezekiah hi son reign in hi stead.

17:1 In the twelfth year of ahaz king of judah began hoshea the son of
elah to reign in samaria over israel nine years.

17:2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, but not
a the king of israel that were befor him.

17:3 against him came up shalmanes king of assyria; and hoshea
becam hi servant, and gave him presents.

17:4 and the king of assyria found conspiraci in hoshea: for he had
sent messeng to So king of egypt, and brought no present to the
k of assyria, as he had done year by year: therefor the king of
assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.

17:5 then the king of assyria came up throughout all the land, and
went up to samaria, and besieg it three years.

17:6 In the ninth year of hoshea the king of assyria took samaria, and
carri israel away into assyria, and place them in halah and in
habor by the river of gozan, and in the citi of the medes.

17:7 for so it was, that the children of israel had sin against the
lord their god, which had brought them up out of the land of egypt,
from under the hand of pharaoh king of egypt, and had fear other
gods, 17:8 and walk in the statut of the heathen, whom the lord
cast out from befor the children of israel, and of the king of
israel, which they had made.

17:9 and the children of israel did secretli those thing that were
not right against the lord their god, and they built them high places
in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced
city.

17:10 and they set them up imag and grove in everi high hill, and
und everi green tree: 17:11 and there they burnt incens in all the
high places, as did the heathen whom the lord carri away before
them; and wrought wick thing to provok the lord to anger: 17:12
for they serv idols, whereof the lord had said unto them, Ye shall
not do thi thing.

17:13 yet the lord testifi against israel, and against judah, by all
th prophets, and by all the seers, saying, turn ye from your evil
ways, and keep my command and my statutes, accord to all the
law which I command your fathers, and which I sent to you by my
serv the prophets.

17:14 notwithstand they would not hear, but harden their necks,
lik to the neck of their fathers, that did not believ in the lord
their god.

17:15 and they reject hi statutes, and hi coven that he made
with their fathers, and hi testimoni which he testifi against
them; and they follow vanity, and becam vain, and went after the
heathen that were round about them, concern whom the lord had
charg them, that they should not do like them.

17:16 and they left all the command of the lord their god, and
mad them molten images, even two calves, and made a grove, and
worship all the host of heaven, and serv baal.

17:17 and they caus their son and their daughter to pass through
th fire, and use divin and enchantments, and sold themselv to
do evil in the sight of the lord, to provok him to anger.

17:18 therefor the lord wa veri angri with israel, and remov them
out of hi sight: there wa none left but the tribe of judah only.

17:19 also judah kept not the command of the lord their god, but
walk in the statut of israel which they made.

17:20 and the lord reject all the seed of israel, and afflicted
them, and deliv them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast
them out of hi sight.

17:21 for he rent israel from the hous of david; and they made
jeroboam the son of nebat king: and jeroboam drave israel from
follow the lord, and made them sin a great sin.

17:22 for the children of israel walk in all the sin of jeroboam
which he did; they depart not from them; 17:23 until the lord
remov israel out of hi sight, as he had said by all hi servants
th prophets. So wa israel carri away out of their own land to
assyria unto thi day.

17:24 and the king of assyria brought men from babylon, and from
cuthah, and from ava, and from hamath, and from sepharvaim, and placed
them in the citi of samaria instead of the children of israel: and
they possess samaria, and dwelt in the citi thereof.

17:25 and so it wa at the begin of their dwell there, that
they fear not the lord: therefor the lord sent lion among them,
which slew some of them.

17:26 wherefor they spake to the king of assyria, saying, the nations
which thou hast removed, and place in the citi of samaria, know not
th manner of the god of the land: therefor he hath sent lion among
them, and, behold, they slay them, becaus they know not the manner of
th god of the land.

17:27 then the king of assyria commanded, saying, carri thither one of
th priest whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell
there, and let him teach them the manner of the god of the land.

17:28 then one of the priest whom they had carri away from samaria
cam and dwelt in bethel, and taught them how they should fear the
lord.

17:29 howbeit everi nation made god of their own, and put them in the
hous of the high place which the samaritan had made, everi nation
in their citi wherein they dwelt.

17:30 and the men of babylon made succothbenoth, and the men of cuth
mad nergal, and the men of hamath made ashima, 17:31 and the avites
mad nibhaz and tartak, and the sepharvit burnt their children in
fir to adrammelech and anammelech, the god of sepharvaim.

17:32 So they fear the lord, and made unto themselv of the lowest
of them priest of the high places, which sacrif for them in the
hous of the high places.

17:33 they fear the lord, and serv their own gods, after the
mann of the nation whom they carri away from thence.

17:34 unto thi day they do after the former manners: they fear not
th lord, neither do they after their statutes, or after their
ordinances, or after the law and command which the lord commanded
th children of jacob, whom he name israel; 17:35 with whom the lord
had made a covenant, and charg them, saying, Ye shall not fear other
gods, nor bow yourselv to them, nor serv them, nor sacrific to
them: 17:36 but the lord, who brought you up out of the land of egypt
with great power and a stretch out arm, him shall ye fear, and him
shal ye worship, and to him shall ye do sacrifice.

17:37 and the statutes, and the ordinances, and the law, and the
commandment, which he wrote for you, ye shall observ to do for
evermore; and ye shall not fear other gods.

17:38 and the coven that I have made with you ye shall not forget;
neith shall ye fear other gods.

17:39 but the lord your god ye shall fear; and he shall deliv you
out of the hand of all your enemies.

17:40 howbeit they did not hearken, but they did after their former
manner.

17:41 So these nation fear the lord, and serv their graven
images, both their children, and their children' children: as did
their fathers, so do they unto thi day.

18:1 now it came to pass in the third year of hoshea son of elah king
of israel, that hezekiah the son of ahaz king of judah began to reign.

18:2 twenti and five year old wa he when he began to reign; and he
reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also was
abi, the daughter of zachariah.

18:3 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that david hi father did.

18:4 He remov the high places, and brake the images, and cut down
th groves, and brake in piec the brasen serpent that mose had
made: for unto those day the children of israel did burn incens to
it: and he call it nehushtan.

18:5 He trust in the lord god of israel; so that after him wa none
lik him among all the king of judah, nor ani that were befor him.

18:6 for he clave to the lord, and depart not from follow him,
but kept hi commandments, which the lord command moses.

18:7 and the lord wa with him; and he prosper whithersoev he went
forth: and he rebel against the king of assyria, and serv him
not.

18:8 He smote the philistines, even unto gaza, and the borders
thereof, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenc city.

18:9 and it came to pass in the fourth year of king hezekiah, which
wa the seventh year of hoshea son of elah king of israel, that
shalmanes king of assyria came up against samaria, and besieg it.

18:10 and at the end of three year they took it: even in the sixth
year of hezekiah, that is in the ninth year of hoshea king of israel,
samaria wa taken.

18:11 and the king of assyria did carri away israel unto assyria, and
put them in halah and in habor by the river of gozan, and in the
citi of the medes: 18:12 becaus they obey not the voic of the
lord their god, but transgress hi covenant, and all that mose the
serv of the lord commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them.

18:13 now in the fourteenth year of king hezekiah did sennacherib king
of assyria come up against all the fenc citi of judah, and took
them.

18:14 and hezekiah king of judah sent to the king of assyria to
lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou
puttest on me will I bear. and the king of assyria appoint unto
hezekiah king of judah three hundr talent of silver and thirty
tal of gold.

18:15 and hezekiah gave him all the silver that wa found in the house
of the lord, and in the treasur of the king' house.

18:16 At that time did hezekiah cut off the gold from the door of the
templ of the lord, and from the pillar which hezekiah king of judah
had overlaid, and gave it to the king of assyria.

18:17 and the king of assyria sent tartan and rabsari and rabshakeh
from lachish to king hezekiah with a great host against jerusalem. and
they went up and came to jerusalem. and when they were come up, they
cam and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the
highway of the fuller' field.

18:18 and when they had call to the king, there came out to them
eliakim the son of hilkiah, which wa over the household, and shebna
th scribe, and joah the son of asaph the recorder.

18:19 and rabshakeh said unto them, speak ye now to hezekiah, thus
saith the great king, the king of assyria, what confid is this
wherein thou trustest?  18:20 thou sayest, (but they are but vain
words,) I have counsel and strength for the war. now on whom dost thou
trust, that thou rebellest against me?  18:21 now, behold, thou
trustest upon the staff of thi bruis reed, even upon egypt, on
which if a man lean, it will go into hi hand, and pierc it: so is
pharaoh king of egypt unto all that trust on him.

18:22 but if ye say unto me, We trust in the lord our god: is not that
he, whose high place and whose altar hezekiah hath taken away, and
hath said to judah and jerusalem, Ye shall worship befor thi altar
in jerusalem?  18:23 now therefore, I pray thee, give pledg to my
lord the king of assyria, and I will deliv thee two thousand horses,
if thou be abl on thi part to set rider upon them.

18:24 how then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the
least of my master' servants, and put thi trust on egypt for chariots
and for horsemen?  18:25 Am I now come up without the lord against
thi place to destroy it?  the lord said to me, Go up against this
land, and destroy it.

18:26 then said eliakim the son of hilkiah, and shebna, and joah, unto
rabshakeh, speak, I pray thee, to thi servant in the syrian language;
for we understand it: and talk not with us in the jews' languag in
th ear of the peopl that are on the wall.

18:27 but rabshakeh said unto them, hath my master sent me to thy
master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the
men which sit on the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink
their own piss with you?  18:28 then rabshakeh stood and cri with a
loud voic in the jews' language, and spake, saying, hear the word of
th great king, the king of assyria: 18:29 thu saith the king, let
not hezekiah deceiv you: for he shall not be abl to deliv you out
of hi hand: 18:30 neither let hezekiah make you trust in the lord,
saying, the lord will sure deliv us, and thi citi shall not be
deliv into the hand of the king of assyria.

18:31 hearken not to hezekiah: for thu saith the king of assyria,
mak an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me, and then
eat ye everi man of hi own vine, and everi one of hi fig tree, and
drink ye everi one the water of hi cistern: 18:32 until I come and
tak you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a
land of bread and vineyards, a land of oil oliv and of honey, that ye
may live, and not die: and hearken not unto hezekiah, when he
persuadeth you, saying, the lord will deliv us.

18:33 hath ani of the god of the nation deliv at all hi land
out of the hand of the king of assyria?  18:34 where are the god of
hamath, and of arpad? where are the god of sepharvaim, hena, and
ivah? have they deliv samaria out of mine hand?  18:35 who are
they among all the god of the countries, that have deliv their
countri out of mine hand, that the lord should deliv jerusalem out
of mine hand?  18:36 but the peopl held their peace, and answer him
not a word: for the king' command was, saying, answer him not.

18:37 then came eliakim the son of hilkiah, which wa over the
household, and shebna the scribe, and joah the son of asaph the
recorder, to hezekiah with their cloth rent, and told him the words
of rabshakeh.

19:1 and it came to pass, when king hezekiah heard it, that he rent
hi clothes, and cover himself with sackcloth, and went into the
hous of the lord.

19:2 and he sent eliakim, which wa over the household, and shebna the
scribe, and the elder of the priests, cover with sackcloth, to
isaiah the prophet the son of amoz.

19:3 and they said unto him, thu saith hezekiah, thi day is a day of
trouble, and of rebuke, and blasphemy; for the children are come to
th birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

19:4 It may be the lord thi god will hear all the word of rabshakeh,
whom the king of assyria hi master hath sent to reproach the living
god; and will reprov the word which the lord thi god hath heard:
wherefor lift up thi prayer for the remnant that are left.

19:5 So the servant of king hezekiah came to isaiah.

19:6 and isaiah said unto them, thu shall ye say to your master, thus
saith the lord, Be not afraid of the word which thou hast heard, with
which the servant of the king of assyria have blasphem me.

19:7 behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour,
and shall return to hi own land; and I will caus him to fall by the
sword in hi own land.

19:8 So rabshakeh returned, and found the king of assyria warring
against libnah: for he had heard that he wa depart from lachish.

19:9 and when he heard say of tirhakah king of ethiopia, behold, he is
com out to fight against thee: he sent messeng again unto
hezekiah, saying, 19:10 thu shall ye speak to hezekiah king of judah,
saying, let not thi god in whom thou trustest deceiv thee, saying,
jerusalem shall not be deliv into the hand of the king of assyria.

19:11 behold, thou hast heard what the king of assyria have done to
al lands, by destroy them utterly: and shalt thou be delivered?
19:12 have the god of the nation deliv them which my fathers
hav destroyed; as gozan, and haran, and rezeph, and the children of
eden which were in thelasar?  19:13 where is the king of hamath, and
th king of arpad, and the king of the citi of sepharvaim, of hena,
and ivah?  19:14 and hezekiah receiv the letter of the hand of the
messengers, and read it: and hezekiah went up into the hous of the
lord, and spread it befor the lord.

19:15 and hezekiah pray befor the lord, and said, O lord god of
israel, which dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the god, even
th alone, of all the kingdom of the earth; thou hast made heaven
and earth.

19:16 lord, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, lord, thine eyes, and
see: and hear the word of sennacherib, which hath sent him to
reproach the live god.

19:17 Of a truth, lord, the king of assyria have destroy the
nat and their lands, 19:18 and have cast their god into the fire:
for they were no gods, but the work of men' hands, wood and stone:
therefor they have destroy them.

19:19 now therefore, O lord our god, I beseech thee, save thou us out
of hi hand, that all the kingdom of the earth may know that thou art
th lord god, even thou only.

19:20 then isaiah the son of amoz sent to hezekiah, saying, thu saith
th lord god of israel, that which thou hast pray to me against
sennacherib king of assyria I have heard.

19:21 thi is the word that the lord hath spoken concern him; the
virgin the daughter of zion hath despis thee, and laugh thee to
scorn; the daughter of jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

19:22 whom hast thou reproach and blasphemed? and against whom hast
thou exalt thi voice, and lift up thine eye on high? even against
th holi one of israel.

19:23 By thi messeng thou hast reproach the lord, and hast said,
with the multitud of my chariot I am come up to the height of the
mountains, to the side of lebanon, and will cut down the tall cedar
tre thereof, and the choic fir tree thereof: and I will enter into
th lodg of hi borders, and into the forest of hi carmel.

19:24 I have dig and drunk strang waters, and with the sole of my
feet have I dri up all the river of besieg places.

19:25 hast thou not heard long ago how I have done it, and of ancient
tim that I have form it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou
shouldest be to lay wast fenc citi into ruinou heaps.

19:26 therefor their inhabit were of small power, they were
dismay and confounded; they were as the grass of the field, and as
th green herb, as the grass on the hous tops, and as corn blasted
befor it be grown up.

19:27 but I know thi abode, and thi go out, and thi come in, and
thi rage against me.

19:28 becaus thi rage against me and thi tumult is come up into mine
ears, therefor I will put my hook in thi nose, and my bridl in thy
lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

19:29 and thi shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat thi year such
th as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which
springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and
plant vineyards, and eat the fruit thereof.

19:30 and the remnant that is escap of the hous of judah shall yet
again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

19:31 for out of jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that
escap out of mount zion: the zeal of the lord of host shall do this.

19:32 therefor thu saith the lord concern the king of assyria, he
shal not come into thi city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come
befor it with shield, nor cast a bank against it.

19:33 By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall
not come into thi city, saith the lord.

19:34 for I will defend thi city, to save it, for mine own sake, and
for my servant david' sake.

19:35 and it came to pass that night, that the angel of the lord went
out, and smote in the camp of the assyrian an hundr fourscor and
fiv thousand: and when they aros earli in the morning, behold, they
wer all dead corpses.

19:36 So sennacherib king of assyria departed, and went and returned,
and dwelt at nineveh.

19:37 and it came to pass, as he wa worship in the hous of
nisroch hi god, that adrammelech and sharez hi son smote him with
th sword: and they escap into the land of armenia. and esarhaddon
hi son reign in hi stead.

20:1 In those day wa hezekiah sick unto death. and the prophet
isaiah the son of amoz came to him, and said unto him, thu saith the
lord, set thine hous in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.

20:2 then he turn hi face to the wall, and pray unto the lord,
saying, 20:3 I beseech thee, O lord, rememb now how I have walked
befor thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that
which is good in thi sight. and hezekiah wept sore.

20:4 and it came to pass, afor isaiah wa gone out into the middle
court, that the word of the lord came to him, saying, 20:5 turn again,
and tell hezekiah the captain of my people, thu saith the lord, the
god of david thi father, I have heard thi prayer, I have seen thy
tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up
unto the hous of the lord.

20:6 and I will add unto thi day fifteen years; and I will deliver
the and thi citi out of the hand of the king of assyria; and I will
defend thi citi for mine own sake, and for my servant david' sake.

20:7 and isaiah said, take a lump of figs. and they took and laid it
on the boil, and he recovered.

20:8 and hezekiah said unto isaiah, what shall be the sign that the
lord will heal me, and that I shall go up into the hous of the lord
th third day?  20:9 and isaiah said, thi sign shalt thou have of the
lord, that the lord will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the
shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?  20:10 and
hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten
degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.

20:11 and isaiah the prophet cri unto the lord: and he brought the
shadow ten degre backward, by which it had gone down in the dial of
ahaz.

20:12 At that time berodachbaladan, the son of baladan, king of
babylon, sent letter and a present unto hezekiah: for he had heard
that hezekiah had been sick.

20:13 and hezekiah hearken unto them, and shew them all the house
of hi preciou things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and
th preciou ointment, and all the hous of hi armour, and all that
wa found in hi treasures: there wa noth in hi house, nor in all
hi dominion, that hezekiah shew them not.

20:14 then came isaiah the prophet unto king hezekiah, and said unto
him, what said these men? and from whenc came they unto thee? and
hezekiah said, they are come from a far country, even from babylon.

20:15 and he said, what have they seen in thine house? and hezekiah
answered, all the thing that are in mine hous have they seen: there
i noth among my treasur that I have not shew them.

20:16 and isaiah said unto hezekiah, hear the word of the lord.

20:17 behold, the day come, that all that is in thine house, and that
which thi father have laid up in store unto thi day, shall be
carri into babylon: noth shall be left, saith the lord.

20:18 and of thi son that shall issu from thee, which thou shalt
beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuch in the palace
of the king of babylon.

20:19 then said hezekiah unto isaiah, good is the word of the lord
which thou hast spoken. and he said, Is it not good, if peac and
truth be in my days?  20:20 and the rest of the act of hezekiah, and
al hi might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought
wat into the city, are they not written in the book of the
chronicl of the king of judah?  20:21 and hezekiah slept with his
fathers: and manasseh hi son reign in hi stead.

21:1 manasseh wa twelv year old when he began to reign, and reigned
fifti and five year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
hephzibah.

21:2 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, after
th abomin of the heathen, whom the lord cast out befor the
children of israel.

21:3 for he built up again the high place which hezekiah hi father
had destroyed; and he rear up altar for baal, and made a grove, as
did ahab king of israel; and worship all the host of heaven, and
serv them.

21:4 and he built altar in the hous of the lord, of which the lord
said, In jerusalem will I put my name.

21:5 and he built altar for all the host of heaven in the two courts
of the hous of the lord.

21:6 and he made hi son pass through the fire, and observ times,
and use enchantments, and dealt with familiar spirit and wizards: he
wrought much wicked in the sight of the lord, to provok him to
anger.

21:7 and he set a graven imag of the grove that he had made in the
house, of which the lord said to david, and to solomon hi son, in
thi house, and in jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all tribe of
israel, will I put my name for ever: 21:8 neither will I make the feet
of israel move ani more out of the land which I gave their fathers;
onli if they will observ to do accord to all that I have commanded
them, and accord to all the law that my servant mose commanded
them.

21:9 but they hearken not: and manasseh seduc them to do more evil
than did the nation whom the lord destroy befor the children of
israel.

21:10 and the lord spake by hi servant the prophets, saying, 21:11
becaus manasseh king of judah hath done these abominations, and hath
don wickedli abov all that the amorit did, which were befor him,
and hath made judah also to sin with hi idols: 21:12 therefor thus
saith the lord god of israel, behold, I am bring such evil upon
jerusalem and judah, that whosoev heareth of it, both hi ear shall
tingle.

21:13 and I will stretch over jerusalem the line of samaria, and the
plummet of the hous of ahab: and I will wipe jerusalem as a man
wipeth a dish, wipe it, and turn it upsid down.

21:14 and I will forsak the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver
them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall becom a prey and
a spoil to all their enemies; 21:15 becaus they have done that which
wa evil in my sight, and have provok me to anger, sinc the day
their father came forth out of egypt, even unto thi day.

21:16 moreov manasseh shed innoc blood veri much, till he had
fil jerusalem from one end to another; besid hi sin wherewith he
mad judah to sin, in do that which wa evil in the sight of the
lord.

21:17 now the rest of the act of manasseh, and all that he did, and
hi sin that he sinned, are they not written in the book of the
chronicl of the king of judah?  21:18 and manasseh slept with his
fathers, and wa buri in the garden of hi own house, in the garden
of uzza: and amon hi son reign in hi stead.

21:19 amon wa twenti and two year old when he began to reign, and he
reign two year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
meshullemeth, the daughter of haruz of jotbah.

21:20 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, as his
fath manasseh did.

21:21 and he walk in all the way that hi father walk in, and
serv the idol that hi father served, and worship them: 21:22
and he forsook the lord god of hi fathers, and walk not in the way
of the lord.

21:23 and the servant of amon conspir against him, and slew the
k in hi own house.

21:24 and the peopl of the land slew all them that had conspired
against king amon; and the peopl of the land made josiah hi son king
in hi stead.

21:25 now the rest of the act of amon which he did, are they not
written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?  21:26
and he wa buri in hi sepulchr in the garden of uzza: and josiah
hi son reign in hi stead.

22:1 josiah wa eight year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
thirti and one year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name wa jedidah,
th daughter of adaiah of boscath.

22:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord, and
walk in all the way of david hi father, and turn not asid to the
right hand or to the left.

22:3 and it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king josiah, that
th king sent shaphan the son of azaliah, the son of meshullam, the
scribe, to the hous of the lord, saying, 22:4 Go up to hilkiah the
high priest, that he may sum the silver which is brought into the
hous of the lord, which the keeper of the door have gather of the
people: 22:5 and let them deliv it into the hand of the doer of the
work, that have the oversight of the hous of the lord: and let them
giv it to the doer of the work which is in the hous of the lord, to
repair the breach of the house, 22:6 unto carpenters, and builders,
and masons, and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the house.

22:7 howbeit there wa no reckon made with them of the money that
wa deliv into their hand, becaus they dealt faithfully.

22:8 and hilkiah the high priest said unto shaphan the scribe, I have
found the book of the law in the hous of the lord. and hilkiah gave
th book to shaphan, and he read it.

22:9 and shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king
word again, and said, thi servant have gather the money that was
found in the house, and have deliv it into the hand of them that
do the work, that have the oversight of the hous of the lord.

22:10 and shaphan the scribe shew the king, saying, hilkiah the
priest hath deliv me a book. and shaphan read it befor the king.

22:11 and it came to pass, when the king had heard the word of the
book of the law, that he rent hi clothes.

22:12 and the king command hilkiah the priest, and ahikam the son of
shaphan, and achbor the son of michaiah, and shaphan the scribe, and
asahiah a servant of the king's, saying, 22:13 Go ye, enquir of the
lord for me, and for the people, and for all judah, concern the
word of thi book that is found: for great is the wrath of the lord
that is kindl against us, becaus our father have not hearkened
unto the word of thi book, to do accord unto all that which is
written concern us.

22:14 So hilkiah the priest, and ahikam, and achbor, and shaphan, and
asahiah, went unto huldah the prophetess, the wife of shallum the son
of tikvah, the son of harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt
in jerusalem in the college;) and they commun with her.

22:15 and she said unto them, thu saith the lord god of israel, tell
th man that sent you to me, 22:16 thu saith the lord, behold, I will
br evil upon thi place, and upon the inhabit thereof, even all
th word of the book which the king of judah hath read: 22:17 because
they have forsaken me, and have burn incens unto other gods, that
they might provok me to anger with all the work of their hands;
therefor my wrath shall be kindl against thi place, and shall not
b quenched.

22:18 but to the king of judah which sent you to enquir of the lord,
thu shall ye say to him, thu saith the lord god of israel, as
touch the word which thou hast heard; 22:19 becaus thine heart
wa tender, and thou hast humbl thyself befor the lord, when thou
heardest what I spake against thi place, and against the inhabitants
thereof, that they should becom a desol and a curse, and hast
rent thi clothes, and wept befor me; I also have heard thee, saith
th lord.

22:20 behold therefore, I will gather thee unto thi fathers, and thou
shalt be gather into thi grave in peace; and thine eye shall not
se all the evil which I will bring upon thi place. and they brought
th king word again.

23:1 and the king sent, and they gather unto him all the elder of
judah and of jerusalem.

23:2 and the king went up into the hous of the lord, and all the men
of judah and all the inhabit of jerusalem with him, and the
priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great:
and he read in their ear all the word of the book of the covenant
which wa found in the hous of the lord.

23:3 and the king stood by a pillar, and made a coven befor the
lord, to walk after the lord, and to keep hi command and his
testimoni and hi statut with all their heart and all their soul,
to perform the word of thi coven that were written in thi book.
and all the peopl stood to the covenant.

23:4 and the king command hilkiah the high priest, and the priests
of the second order, and the keeper of the door, to bring forth out
of the templ of the lord all the vessel that were made for baal, and
for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burn them
without jerusalem in the field of kidron, and carri the ash of
them unto bethel.

23:5 and he put down the idolatr priests, whom the king of judah
had ordain to burn incens in the high place in the citi of
judah, and in the place round about jerusalem; them also that burned
incens unto baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets,
and to all the host of heaven.

23:6 and he brought out the grove from the hous of the lord, without
jerusalem, unto the brook kidron, and burn it at the brook kidron,
and stamp it small to powder, and cast the powder thereof upon the
grav of the children of the people.

23:7 and he brake down the hous of the sodomites, that were by the
hous of the lord, where the women wove hang for the grove.

23:8 and he brought all the priest out of the citi of judah, and
defil the high place where the priest had burn incense, from
geba to beersheba, and brake down the high place of the gate that
wer in the enter in of the gate of joshua the governor of the
city, which were on a man' left hand at the gate of the city.

23:9 nevertheless the priest of the high place came not up to the
altar of the lord in jerusalem, but they did eat of the unleavened
bread among their brethren.

23:10 and he defil topheth, which is in the valley of the children
of hinnom, that no man might make hi son or hi daughter to pass
through the fire to molech.

23:11 and he took away the hors that the king of judah had given to
th sun, at the enter in of the hous of the lord, by the chamber
of nathanmelech the chamberlain, which wa in the suburbs, and burned
th chariot of the sun with fire.

23:12 and the altar that were on the top of the upper chamber of
ahaz, which the king of judah had made, and the altar which manasseh
had made in the two court of the hous of the lord, did the king beat
down, and brake them down from thence, and cast the dust of them into
th brook kidron.

23:13 and the high place that were befor jerusalem, which were on
th right hand of the mount of corruption, which solomon the king of
israel had build for ashtoreth the abomin of the zidonians, and
for chemosh the abomin of the moabites, and for milcom the
abomin of the children of ammon, did the king defile.

23:14 and he brake in piec the images, and cut down the groves, and
fil their place with the bone of men.

23:15 moreov the altar that wa at bethel, and the high place which
jeroboam the son of nebat, who made israel to sin, had made, both that
altar and the high place he brake down, and burn the high place, and
stamp it small to powder, and burn the grove.

23:16 and as josiah turn himself, he spi the sepulchr that were
ther in the mount, and sent, and took the bone out of the
sepulchres, and burn them upon the altar, and pollut it, according
to the word of the lord which the man of god proclaimed, who
proclaim these words.

23:17 then he said, what titl is that that I see? and the men of the
citi told him, It is the sepulchr of the man of god, which came from
judah, and proclaim these thing that thou hast done against the
altar of bethel.

23:18 and he said, let him alone; let no man move hi bones. So they
let hi bone alone, with the bone of the prophet that came out of
samaria.

23:19 and all the hous also of the high place that were in the
citi of samaria, which the king of israel had made to provok the
lord to anger, josiah took away, and did to them accord to all the
act that he had done in bethel.

23:20 and he slew all the priest of the high place that were there
upon the altars, and burn men' bone upon them, and return to
jerusalem.

23:21 and the king command all the people, saying, keep the passover
unto the lord your god, as it is written in the book of thi covenant.

23:22 sure there wa not holden such a passov from the day of the
judg that judg israel, nor in all the day of the king of israel,
nor of the king of judah; 23:23 but in the eighteenth year of king
josiah, wherein thi passov wa holden to the lord in jerusalem.

23:24 moreov the worker with familiar spirits, and the wizards, and
th images, and the idols, and all the abomin that were spi in
th land of judah and in jerusalem, did josiah put away, that he might
perform the word of the law which were written in the book that
hilkiah the priest found in the hous of the lord.

23:25 and like unto him wa there no king befor him, that turn to
th lord with all hi heart, and with all hi soul, and with all his
might, accord to all the law of moses; neither after him arose
ther ani like him.

23:26 notwithstand the lord turn not from the fierc of his
great wrath, wherewith hi anger wa kindl against judah, becaus of
al the provoc that manasseh had provok him withal.

23:27 and the lord said, I will remov judah also out of my sight, as
i have remov israel, and will cast off thi citi jerusalem which i
hav chosen, and the hous of which I said, My name shall be there.

23:28 now the rest of the act of josiah, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
23:29 In hi day pharaohnechoh king of egypt went up against the king
of assyria to the river euphrates: and king josiah went against him;
and he slew him at megiddo, when he had seen him.

23:30 and hi servant carri him in a chariot dead from megiddo, and
brought him to jerusalem, and buri him in hi own sepulchre. and the
peopl of the land took jehoahaz the son of josiah, and anoint him,
and made him king in hi father' stead.

23:31 jehoahaz wa twenti and three year old when he began to reign;
and he reign three month in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
hamutal, the daughter of jeremiah of libnah.

23:32 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father had done.

23:33 and pharaohnechoh put him in band at riblah in the land of
hamath, that he might not reign in jerusalem; and put the land to a
tribut of an hundr talent of silver, and a talent of gold.

23:34 and pharaohnechoh made eliakim the son of josiah king in the
room of josiah hi father, and turn hi name to jehoiakim, and took
jehoahaz away: and he came to egypt, and die there.

23:35 and jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to pharaoh; but he
tax the land to give the money accord to the command of
pharaoh: he exact the silver and the gold of the peopl of the land,
of everi one accord to hi taxation, to give it unto pharaohnechoh.

23:36 jehoiakim wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign;
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
zebudah, the daughter of pedaiah of rumah.

23:37 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father had done.

24:1 In hi day nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came up, and jehoiakim
becam hi servant three years: then he turn and rebel against
him.

24:2 and the lord sent against him band of the chaldees, and band of
th syrians, and band of the moabites, and band of the children of
ammon, and sent them against judah to destroy it, accord to the
word of the lord, which he spake by hi servant the prophets.

24:3 sure at the command of the lord came thi upon judah, to
remov them out of hi sight, for the sin of manasseh, accord to
al that he did; 24:4 and also for the innoc blood that he shed:
for he fill jerusalem with innoc blood; which the lord would not
pardon.

24:5 now the rest of the act of jehoiakim, and all that he did, are
they not written in the book of the chronicl of the king of judah?
24:6 So jehoiakim slept with hi fathers: and jehoiachin hi son
reign in hi stead.

24:7 and the king of egypt came not again ani more out of hi land:
for the king of babylon had taken from the river of egypt unto the
riv euphrat all that pertain to the king of egypt.

24:8 jehoiachin wa eighteen year old when he began to reign, and he
reign in jerusalem three months. and hi mother' name wa nehushta,
th daughter of elnathan of jerusalem.

24:9 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father had done.

24:10 At that time the servant of nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came
up against jerusalem, and the citi wa besieged.

24:11 and nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came against the city, and
hi servant did besieg it.

24:12 and jehoiachin the king of judah went out to the king of
babylon, he, and hi mother, and hi servants, and hi princes, and
hi officers: and the king of babylon took him in the eighth year of
hi reign.

24:13 and he carri out thenc all the treasur of the hous of the
