lord, and the treasur of the king' house, and cut in piec all the
vessel of gold which solomon king of israel had made in the templ of
th lord, as the lord had said.

24:14 and he carri away all jerusalem, and all the princes, and all
th mighti men of valour, even ten thousand captives, and all the
craftsmen and smiths: none remained, save the poorest sort of the
peopl of the land.

24:15 and he carri away jehoiachin to babylon, and the king's
mother, and the king' wives, and hi officers, and the mighti of the
land, those carri he into captiv from jerusalem to babylon.

24:16 and all the men of might, even seven thousand, and craftsmen and
smith a thousand, all that were strong and apt for war, even them the
k of babylon brought captiv to babylon.

24:17 and the king of babylon made mattaniah hi father' brother king
in hi stead, and chang hi name to zedekiah.

24:18 zedekiah wa twenti and one year old when he began to reign,
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
hamutal, the daughter of jeremiah of libnah.

24:19 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that jehoiakim had done.

24:20 for through the anger of the lord it came to pass in jerusalem
and judah, until he had cast them out from hi presence, that zedekiah
rebel against the king of babylon.

25:1 and it came to pass in the ninth year of hi reign, in the tenth
month, in the tenth day of the month, that nebuchadnezzar king of
babylon came, he, and all hi host, against jerusalem, and pitched
against it; and they built fort against it round about.

25:2 and the citi wa besieg unto the eleventh year of king
zedekiah.

25:3 and on the ninth day of the fourth month the famin prevail in
th city, and there wa no bread for the peopl of the land.

25:4 and the citi wa broken up, and all the men of war fled by night
bi the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king's
garden: (now the chalde were against the citi round about:) and the
k went the way toward the plain.

25:5 and the armi of the chalde pursu after the king, and overtook
him in the plain of jericho: and all hi armi were scatter from
him.

25:6 So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of babylon
to riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.

25:7 and they slew the son of zedekiah befor hi eyes, and put out
th eye of zedekiah, and bound him with fetter of brass, and carried
him to babylon.

25:8 and in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is
th nineteenth year of king nebuchadnezzar king of babylon, came
nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of babylon,
unto jerusalem: 25:9 and he burnt the hous of the lord, and the
king' house, and all the hous of jerusalem, and everi great man's
hous burnt he with fire.

25:10 and all the armi of the chaldees, that were with the captain of
th guard, brake down the wall of jerusalem round about.

25:11 now the rest of the peopl that were left in the city, and the
fugit that fell away to the king of babylon, with the remnant of
th multitude, did nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away.

25:12 but the captain of the guard left of the door of the poor of the
land to be vinedress and husbandmen.

25:13 and the pillar of brass that were in the hous of the lord, and
th bases, and the brasen sea that wa in the hous of the lord, did
th chalde break in pieces, and carri the brass of them to
babylon.

25:14 and the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons,
and all the vessel of brass wherewith they ministered, took they
away.

25:15 and the firepans, and the bowls, and such thing as were of
gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took
away.

25:16 the two pillars, one sea, and the base which solomon had made
for the hous of the lord; the brass of all these vessel wa without
weight.

25:17 the height of the one pillar wa eighteen cubits, and the
chapit upon it wa brass: and the height of the chapit three
cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegran upon the chapiter
round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar
with wreathen work.

25:18 and the captain of the guard took seraiah the chief priest, and
zephaniah the second priest, and the three keeper of the door: 25:19
and out of the citi he took an offic that wa set over the men of
war, and five men of them that were in the king' presence, which were
found in the city, and the princip scribe of the host, which
must the peopl of the land, and threescor men of the peopl of
th land that were found in the city: 25:20 and nebuzaradan captain of
th guard took these, and brought them to the king of babylon to
riblah: 25:21 and the king of babylon smote them, and slew them at
riblah in the land of hamath. So judah wa carri away out of their
land.

25:22 and as for the peopl that remain in the land of judah, whom
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon had left, even over them he made
gedaliah the son of ahikam, the son of shaphan, ruler.

25:23 and when all the captain of the armies, they and their men,
heard that the king of babylon had made gedaliah governor, there came
to gedaliah to mizpah, even ishmael the son of nethaniah, and johanan
th son of careah, and seraiah the son of tanhumeth the netophathite,
and jaazaniah the son of a maachathite, they and their men.

25:24 and gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto
them, fear not to be the servant of the chaldees: dwell in the land,
and serv the king of babylon; and it shall be well with you.

25:25 but it came to pass in the seventh month, that ishmael the son
of nethaniah, the son of elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten
men with him, and smote gedaliah, that he died, and the jew and the
chalde that were with him at mizpah.

25:26 and all the people, both small and great, and the captain of
th armies, arose, and came to egypt: for they were afraid of the
chaldees.

25:27 and it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the
capt of jehoiachin king of judah, in the twelfth month, on the
seven and twentieth day of the month, that evilmerodach king of
babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of
jehoiachin king of judah out of prison; 25:28 and he spake kindli to
him, and set hi throne abov the throne of the king that were with
him in babylon; 25:29 and chang hi prison garments: and he did eat
bread continu befor him all the day of hi life.

25:30 and hi allow wa a continu allow given him of the
king, a daili rate for everi day, all the day of hi life.




th first book of the chronicles


1:1 adam, sheth, enosh, 1:2 kenan, mahalaleel, jered, 1:3 henoch,
methuselah, lamech, 1:4 noah, shem, ham, and japheth.

1:5 the son of japheth; gomer, and magog, and madai, and javan, and
tubal, and meshech, and tiras.

1:6 and the son of gomer; ashchenaz, and riphath, and togarmah.

1:7 and the son of javan; elishah, and tarshish, kittim, and dodanim.

1:8 the son of ham; cush, and mizraim, put, and canaan.

1:9 and the son of cush; seba, and havilah, and sabta, and raamah,
and sabtecha. and the son of raamah; sheba, and dedan.

1:10 and cush begat nimrod: he began to be mighti upon the earth.

1:11 and mizraim begat ludim, and anamim, and lehabim, and naphtuhim,
1:12 and pathrusim, and casluhim, (of whom came the philistines,) and
caphthorim.

1:13 and canaan begat zidon hi firstborn, and heth, 1:14 the jebusite
also, and the amorite, and the girgashite, 1:15 and the hivite, and
th arkite, and the sinite, 1:16 and the arvadite, and the zemarite,
and the hamathite.

1:17 the son of shem; elam, and asshur, and arphaxad, and lud, and
aram, and uz, and hul, and gether, and meshech.

1:18 and arphaxad begat shelah, and shelah begat eber.

1:19 and unto eber were born two sons: the name of the one wa peleg;
becaus in hi day the earth wa divided: and hi brother' name was
joktan.

1:20 and joktan begat almodad, and sheleph, and hazarmaveth, and
jerah, 1:21 hadoram also, and uzal, and diklah, 1:22 and ebal, and
abimael, and sheba, 1:23 and ophir, and havilah, and jobab. all these
wer the son of joktan.

1:24 shem, arphaxad, shelah, 1:25 eber, peleg, reu, 1:26 serug, nahor,
terah, 1:27 abram; the same is abraham.

1:28 the son of abraham; isaac, and ishmael.

1:29 these are their generations: the firstborn of ishmael, nebaioth;
then kedar, and adbeel, and mibsam, 1:30 mishma, and dumah, massa,
hadad, and tema, 1:31 jetur, naphish, and kedemah. these are the sons
of ishmael.

1:32 now the son of keturah, abraham' concubine: she bare zimran,
and jokshan, and medan, and midian, and ishbak, and shuah. and the
son of jokshan; sheba, and dedan.

1:33 and the son of midian; ephah, and epher, and henoch, and abida,
and eldaah. all these are the son of keturah.

1:34 and abraham begat isaac. the son of isaac; esau and israel.

1:35 the son of esau; eliphaz, reuel, and jeush, and jaalam, and
korah.

1:36 the son of eliphaz; teman, and omar, zephi, and gatam, kenaz,
and timna, and amalek.

1:37 the son of reuel; nahath, zerah, shammah, and mizzah.

1:38 and the son of seir; lotan, and shobal, and zibeon, and anah,
and dishon, and ezar, and dishan.

1:39 and the son of lotan; hori, and homam: and timna wa lotan's
sister.

1:40 the son of shobal; alian, and manahath, and ebal, shephi, and
onam.

and the son of zibeon; aiah, and anah.

1:41 the son of anah; dishon. and the son of dishon; amram, and
eshban, and ithran, and cheran.

1:42 the son of ezer; bilhan, and zavan, and jakan. the son of
dishan; uz, and aran.

1:43 now these are the king that reign in the land of edom before
ani king reign over the children of israel; bela the son of beor:
and the name of hi citi wa dinhabah.

1:44 and when bela wa dead, jobab the son of zerah of bozrah reigned
in hi stead.

1:45 and when jobab wa dead, husham of the land of the temanites
reign in hi stead.

1:46 and when husham wa dead, hadad the son of bedad, which smote
midian in the field of moab, reign in hi stead: and the name of his
citi wa avith.

1:47 and when hadad wa dead, samlah of masrekah reign in hi stead.

1:48 and when samlah wa dead, shaul of rehoboth by the river reigned
in hi stead.

1:49 and when shaul wa dead, baalhanan the son of achbor reign in
hi stead.

1:50 and when baalhanan wa dead, hadad reign in hi stead: and the
nam of hi citi wa pai; and hi wife' name wa mehetabel, the
daught of matred, the daughter of mezahab.

1:51 hadad die also. and the duke of edom were; duke timnah, duke
aliah, duke jetheth, 1:52 duke aholibamah, duke elah, duke pinon, 1:53
duke kenaz, duke teman, duke mibzar, 1:54 duke magdiel, duke iram.
thes are the duke of edom.

2:1 these are the son of israel; reuben, simeon, levi, and judah,
issachar, and zebulun, 2:2 dan, joseph, and benjamin, naphtali, gad,
and asher.

2:3 the son of judah; er, and onan, and shelah: which three were born
unto him of the daughter of shua the canaanitess. and er, the
firstborn of judah, wa evil in the sight of the lord; and he slew
him.

2:4 and tamar hi daughter in law bore him pharez and zerah. all the
son of judah were five.

2:5 the son of pharez; hezron, and hamul.

2:6 and the son of zerah; zimri, and ethan, and heman, and calcol,
and dara: five of them in all.

2:7 and the son of carmi; achar, the troubler of israel, who
transgress in the thing accursed.

2:8 and the son of ethan; azariah.

2:9 the son also of hezron, that were born unto him; jerahmeel, and
ram, and chelubai.

2:10 and ram begat amminadab; and amminadab begat nahshon, princ of
th children of judah; 2:11 and nahshon begat salma, and salma begat
boaz, 2:12 and boaz begat obed, and obe begat jesse, 2:13 and jesse
begat hi firstborn eliab, and abinadab the second, and shimma the
third, 2:14 nethaneel the fourth, raddai the fifth, 2:15 ozem the
sixth, david the seventh: 2:16 whose sister were zeruiah, and
abigail. and the son of zeruiah; abishai, and joab, and asahel,
three.

2:17 and abigail bare amasa: and the father of amasa wa jether the
ishmeelite.

2:18 and caleb the son of hezron begat children of azubah hi wife,
and of jerioth: her son are these; jesher, and shobab, and ardon.

2:19 and when azubah wa dead, caleb took unto him ephrath, which bare
him hur.

2:20 and hur begat uri, and uri begat bezaleel.

2:21 and afterward hezron went in to the daughter of machir the father
of gilead, whom he marri when he wa threescor year old; and she
bar him segub.

2:22 and segub begat jair, who had three and twenti citi in the land
of gilead.

2:23 and he took geshur, and aram, with the town of jair, from them,
with kenath, and the town thereof, even threescor cities. all these
belong to the son of machir the father of gilead.

2:24 and after that hezron wa dead in calebephratah, then abiah
hezron' wife bare him ashur the father of tekoa.

2:25 and the son of jerahmeel the firstborn of hezron were, ram the
firstborn, and bunah, and oren, and ozem, and ahijah.

2:26 jerahmeel had also anoth wife, whose name wa atarah; she was
th mother of onam.

2:27 and the son of ram the firstborn of jerahmeel were, maaz, and
jamin, and eker.

2:28 and the son of onam were, shammai, and jada. and the son of
shammai; nadab and abishur.

2:29 and the name of the wife of abishur wa abihail, and she bare him
ahban, and molid.

2:30 and the son of nadab; seled, and appaim: but sele die without
children.

2:31 and the son of appaim; ishi. and the son of ishi; sheshan. and
th children of sheshan; ahlai.

2:32 and the son of jada the brother of shammai; jether, and
jonathan: and jether die without children.

2:33 and the son of jonathan; peleth, and zaza. these were the sons
of jerahmeel.

2:34 now sheshan had no sons, but daughters. and sheshan had a
servant, an egyptian, whose name wa jarha.

2:35 and sheshan gave hi daughter to jarha hi servant to wife; and
sh bare him attai.

2:36 and attai begat nathan, and nathan begat zabad, 2:37 and zabad
begat ephlal, and ephlal begat obed, 2:38 and obe begat jehu, and
jehu begat azariah, 2:39 and azariah begat helez, and helez begat
eleasah, 2:40 and eleasah begat sisamai, and sisamai begat shallum,
2:41 and shallum begat jekamiah, and jekamiah begat elishama.

2:42 now the son of caleb the brother of jerahmeel were, mesha his
firstborn, which wa the father of ziph; and the son of mareshah the
fath of hebron.

2:43 and the son of hebron; korah, and tappuah, and rekem, and shema.

2:44 and shema begat raham, the father of jorkoam: and rekem begat
shammai.

2:45 and the son of shammai wa maon: and maon wa the father of
bethzur.

2:46 and ephah, caleb' concubine, bare haran, and moza, and gazez:
and haran begat gazez.

2:47 and the son of jahdai; regem, and jotham, and gesham, and pelet,
and ephah, and shaaph.

2:48 maachah, caleb' concubine, bare sheber, and tirhanah.

2:49 she bare also shaaph the father of madmannah, sheva the father of
machbenah, and the father of gibea: and the daughter of caleb was
achsa.

2:50 these were the son of caleb the son of hur, the firstborn of
ephratah; shobal the father of kirjathjearim.

2:51 salma the father of bethlehem, hareph the father of bethgader.

2:52 and shobal the father of kirjathjearim had sons; haroeh, and half
of the manahethites.

2:53 and the famili of kirjathjearim; the ithrites, and the puhites,
and the shumathites, and the mishraites; of them came the zareathites,
and the eshtaulites, 2:54 the son of salma; bethlehem, and the
netophathites, ataroth, the hous of joab, and half of the
manahethites, the zorites.

2:55 and the famili of the scribe which dwelt at jabez; the
tirathites, the shimeathites, and suchathites. these are the kenites
that came of hemath, the father of the hous of rechab.

3:1 now these were the son of david, which were born unto him in
hebron; the firstborn amnon, of ahinoam the jezreelitess; the second
daniel, of abigail the carmelitess: 3:2 the third, absalom the son of
maachah the daughter of talmai king of geshur: the fourth, adonijah
th son of haggith: 3:3 the fifth, shephatiah of abital: the sixth,
ithream by eglah hi wife.

3:4 these six were born unto him in hebron; and there he reign seven
year and six months: and in jerusalem he reign thirti and three
years.

3:5 and these were born unto him in jerusalem; shimea, and shobab, and
nathan, and solomon, four, of bathshua the daughter of ammiel: 3:6
ibhar also, and elishama, and eliphelet, 3:7 and nogah, and nepheg,
and japhia, 3:8 and elishama, and eliada, and eliphelet, nine.

3:9 these were all the son of david, besid the son of the
concubines, and tamar their sister.

3:10 and solomon' son wa rehoboam, abia hi son, asa hi son,
jehoshaphat hi son, 3:11 joram hi son, ahaziah hi son, joash his
son, 3:12 amaziah hi son, azariah hi son, jotham hi son, 3:13 ahaz
hi son, hezekiah hi son, manasseh hi son, 3:14 amon hi son, josiah
hi son.

3:15 and the son of josiah were, the firstborn johanan, the second
jehoiakim, the third zedekiah, the fourth shallum.

3:16 and the son of jehoiakim: jeconiah hi son, zedekiah hi son.

3:17 and the son of jeconiah; assir, salathiel hi son, 3:18
malchiram also, and pedaiah, and shenazar, jecamiah, hoshama, and
nedabiah.

3:19 and the son of pedaiah were, zerubbabel, and shimei: and the
son of zerubbabel; meshullam, and hananiah, and shelomith their
sister: 3:20 and hashubah, and ohel, and berechiah, and hasadiah,
jushabhesed, five.

3:21 and the son of hananiah; pelatiah, and jesaiah: the son of
rephaiah, the son of arnan, the son of obadiah, the son of
shechaniah.

3:22 and the son of shechaniah; shemaiah: and the son of shemaiah;
hattush, and igeal, and bariah, and neariah, and shaphat, six.

3:23 and the son of neariah; elioenai, and hezekiah, and azrikam,
three.

3:24 and the son of elioenai were, hodaiah, and eliashib, and
pelaiah, and akkub, and johanan, and dalaiah, and anani, seven.

4:1 the son of judah; pharez, hezron, and carmi, and hur, and shobal.

4:2 and reaiah the son of shobal begat jahath; and jahath begat
ahumai, and lahad. these are the famili of the zorathites.

4:3 and these were of the father of etam; jezreel, and ishma, and
idbash: and the name of their sister wa hazelelponi: 4:4 and penuel
th father of gedor, and ezer the father of hushah. these are the sons
of hur, the firstborn of ephratah, the father of bethlehem.

4:5 and ashur the father of tekoa had two wives, helah and naarah.

4:6 and naarah bare him ahuzam, and hepher, and temeni, and
haahashtari.

thes were the son of naarah.

4:7 and the son of helah were, zereth, and jezoar, and ethnan.

4:8 and coz begat anub, and zobebah, and the famili of aharhel the
son of harum.

4:9 and jabez wa more honour than hi brethren: and hi mother
cal hi name jabez, saying, becaus I bare him with sorrow.

4:10 and jabez call on the god of israel, saying, Oh that thou
wouldest bless me indeed, and enlarg my coast, and that thine hand
might be with me, and that thou wouldest keep me from evil, that it
may not griev me! and god grant him that which he requested.

4:11 and chelub the brother of shuah begat mehir, which wa the father
of eshton.

4:12 and eshton begat bethrapha, and paseah, and tehinnah the father
of irnahash. these are the men of rechah.

4:13 and the son of kenaz; othniel, and seraiah: and the son of
othniel; hathath.

4:14 and meonothai begat ophrah: and seraiah begat joab, the father of
th valley of charashim; for they were craftsmen.

4:15 and the son of caleb the son of jephunneh; iru, elah, and naam:
and the son of elah, even kenaz.

4:16 and the son of jehaleleel; ziph, and ziphah, tiria, and asareel.

4:17 and the son of ezra were, jether, and mered, and epher, and
jalon: and she bare miriam, and shammai, and ishbah the father of
eshtemoa.

4:18 and hi wife jehudijah bare jere the father of gedor, and heber
th father of socho, and jekuthiel the father of zanoah. and these are
th son of bithiah the daughter of pharaoh, which mere took.

4:19 and the son of hi wife hodiah the sister of naham, the father
of keilah the garmite, and eshtemoa the maachathite.

4:20 and the son of shimon were, amnon, and rinnah, benhanan, and
tilon.

and the son of ishi were, zoheth, and benzoheth.

4:21 the son of shelah the son of judah were, Er the father of lecah,
and laadah the father of mareshah, and the famili of the hous of
them that wrought fine linen, of the hous of ashbea, 4:22 and jokim,
and the men of chozeba, and joash, and saraph, who had the dominion in
moab, and jashubilehem. and these are ancient things.

4:23 these were the potters, and those that dwelt among plant and
hedges: there they dwelt with the king for hi work.

4:24 the son of simeon were, nemuel, and jamin, jarib, zerah, and
shaul: 4:25 shallum hi son, mibsam hi son, mishma hi son.

4:26 and the son of mishma; hamuel hi son, zacchur hi son, shimei
hi son.

4:27 and shimei had sixteen son and six daughters: but hi brethren
had not mani children, neither did all their famili multiply, like to
th children of judah.

4:28 and they dwelt at beersheba, and moladah, and hazarshual, 4:29
and at bilhah, and at ezem, and at tolad, 4:30 and at bethuel, and at
hormah, and at ziklag, 4:31 and at bethmarcaboth, and hazarsusim, and
at bethbirei, and at shaaraim. these were their citi unto the reign
of david.

4:32 and their villag were, etam, and ain, rimmon, and tochen, and
ashan, five cities: 4:33 and all their villag that were round about
th same cities, unto baal. these were their habitations, and their
genealogy.

4:34 and meshobab, and jamlech, and joshah, the son of amaziah, 4:35
and joel, and jehu the son of josibiah, the son of seraiah, the son of
asiel, 4:36 and elioenai, and jaakobah, and jeshohaiah, and asaiah,
and adiel, and jesimiel, and benaiah, 4:37 and ziza the son of shiphi,
th son of allon, the son of jedaiah, the son of shimri, the son of
shemaiah; 4:38 these mention by their name were princ in their
families: and the hous of their father increas greatly.

4:39 and they went to the entranc of gedor, even unto the east side
of the valley, to seek pastur for their flocks.

4:40 and they found fat pastur and good, and the land wa wide, and
quiet, and peaceable; for they of ham had dwelt there of old.

4:41 and these written by name came in the day of hezekiah king of
judah, and smote their tents, and the habit that were found
there, and destroy them utterli unto thi day, and dwelt in their
rooms: becaus there wa pastur there for their flocks.

4:42 and some of them, even of the son of simeon, five hundr men,
went to mount seir, have for their captain pelatiah, and neariah,
and rephaiah, and uzziel, the son of ishi.

4:43 and they smote the rest of the amalekit that were escaped, and
dwelt there unto thi day.

5:1 now the son of reuben the firstborn of israel, (for he wa the
firstborn; but forasmuch as he defil hi father' bed, his
birthright wa given unto the son of joseph the son of israel: and
th genealog is not to be reckon after the birthright.

5:2 for judah prevail abov hi brethren, and of him came the chief
ruler; but the birthright wa joseph's:) 5:3 the sons, I say, of
reuben the firstborn of israel were, hanoch, and pallu, hezron, and
carmi.

5:4 the son of joel; shemaiah hi son, gog hi son, shimei hi son,
5:5 micah hi son, reaia hi son, baal hi son, 5:6 beerah hi son,
whom tilgathpilnes king of assyria carri away captive: he was
princ of the reubenites.

5:7 and hi brethren by their families, when the genealog of their
gener wa reckoned, were the chief, jeiel, and zechariah, 5:8
and bela the son of azaz, the son of shema, the son of joel, who dwelt
in aroer, even unto nebo and baalmeon: 5:9 and eastward he inhabited
unto the enter in of the wilder from the river euphrates:
becaus their cattl were multipli in the land of gilead.

5:10 and in the day of saul they made war with the hagarites, who
fel by their hand: and they dwelt in their tent throughout all the
east land of gilead.

5:11 and the children of gad dwelt over against them, in the land of
bashan unto salcah: 5:12 joel the chief, and shapham the next, and
jaanai, and shaphat in bashan.

5:13 and their brethren of the hous of their father were, michael,
and meshullam, and sheba, and jorai, and jachan, and zia, and heber,
seven.

5:14 these are the children of abihail the son of huri, the son of
jaroah, the son of gilead, the son of michael, the son of jeshishai,
th son of jahdo, the son of buz; 5:15 ahi the son of abdiel, the son
of guni, chief of the hous of their fathers.

5:16 and they dwelt in gilead in bashan, and in her towns, and in all
th suburb of sharon, upon their borders.

5:17 all these were reckon by genealog in the day of jotham king
of judah, and in the day of jeroboam king of israel.

5:18 the son of reuben, and the gadites, and half the tribe of
manasseh, of valiant men, men abl to bear buckler and sword, and to
shoot with bow, and skil in war, were four and forti thousand seven
hundr and threescore, that went out to the war.

5:19 and they made war with the hagarites, with jetur, and nephish,
and nodab.

5:20 and they were help against them, and the hagarit were
deliv into their hand, and all that were with them: for they cried
to god in the battle, and he wa intreat of them; becaus they put
their trust in him.

5:21 and they took away their cattle; of their camel fifti thousand,
and of sheep two hundr and fifti thousand, and of ass two
thousand, and of men an hundr thousand.

5:22 for there fell down mani slain, becaus the war wa of god. and
they dwelt in their stead until the captivity.

5:23 and the children of the half tribe of manasseh dwelt in the land:
they increas from bashan unto baalhermon and senir, and unto mount
hermon.

5:24 and these were the head of the hous of their fathers, even
epher, and ishi, and eliel, and azriel, and jeremiah, and hodaviah,
and jahdiel, mighti men of valour, famou men, and head of the house
of their fathers.

5:25 and they transgress against the god of their fathers, and went
a whore after the god of the peopl of the land, whom god destroyed
befor them.

5:26 and the god of israel stir up the spirit of pul king of
assyria, and the spirit of tilgathpilnes king of assyria, and he
carri them away, even the reubenites, and the gadites, and the half
trib of manasseh, and brought them unto halah, and habor, and hara,
and to the river gozan, unto thi day.

6:1 the son of levi; gershon, kohath, and merari.

6:2 and the son of kohath; amram, izhar, and hebron, and uzziel.

6:3 and the children of amram; aaron, and moses, and miriam. the sons
also of aaron; nadab, and abihu, eleazar, and ithamar.

6:4 eleazar begat phinehas, phineha begat abishua, 6:5 and abishua
begat bukki, and bukki begat uzzi, 6:6 and uzzi begat zerahiah, and
zerahiah begat meraioth, 6:7 meraioth begat amariah, and amariah begat
ahitub, 6:8 and ahitub begat zadok, and zadok begat ahimaaz, 6:9 and
ahimaaz begat azariah, and azariah begat johanan, 6:10 and johanan
begat azariah, (he it is that execut the priest' offic in the
templ that solomon built in jerusalem:) 6:11 and azariah begat
amariah, and amariah begat ahitub, 6:12 and ahitub begat zadok, and
zadok begat shallum, 6:13 and shallum begat hilkiah, and hilkiah begat
azariah, 6:14 and azariah begat seraiah, and seraiah begat jehozadak,
6:15 and jehozadak went into captivity, when the lord carri away
judah and jerusalem by the hand of nebuchadnezzar.

6:16 the son of levi; gershom, kohath, and merari.

6:17 and these be the name of the son of gershom; libni, and shimei.

6:18 and the son of kohath were, amram, and izhar, and hebron, and
uzziel.

6:19 the son of merari; mahli, and mushi. and these are the families
of the levit accord to their fathers.

6:20 Of gershom; libni hi son, jahath hi son, zimmah hi son, 6:21
joah hi son, iddo hi son, zerah hi son, jeaterai hi son.

6:22 the son of kohath; amminadab hi son, korah hi son, assir his
son, 6:23 elkanah hi son, and ebiasaph hi son, and assir hi son,
6:24 tahath hi son, uriel hi son, uzziah hi son, and shaul hi son.

6:25 and the son of elkanah; amasai, and ahimoth.

6:26 As for elkanah: the son of elkanah; zophai hi son, and nahath
hi son, 6:27 eliab hi son, jeroham hi son, elkanah hi son.

6:28 and the son of samuel; the firstborn vashni, and abiah.

6:29 the son of merari; mahli, libni hi son, shimei hi son, uzza
hi son, 6:30 shimea hi son, haggiah hi son, asaiah hi son.

6:31 and these are they whom david set over the servic of song in the
hous of the lord, after that the ark had rest.

6:32 and they minist befor the dwell place of the tabernacle
of the congreg with singing, until solomon had built the hous of
th lord in jerusalem: and then they wait on their offic according
to their order.

6:33 and these are they that wait with their children. Of the sons
of the kohathites: heman a singer, the son of joel, the son of
shemuel, 6:34 the son of elkanah, the son of jeroham, the son of
eliel, the son of toah, 6:35 the son of zuph, the son of elkanah, the
son of mahath, the son of amasai, 6:36 the son of elkanah, the son of
joel, the son of azariah, the son of zephaniah, 6:37 the son of
tahath, the son of assir, the son of ebiasaph, the son of korah, 6:38
the son of izhar, the son of kohath, the son of levi, the son of
israel.

6:39 and hi brother asaph, who stood on hi right hand, even asaph
th son of berachiah, the son of shimea, 6:40 the son of michael, the
son of baaseiah, the son of malchiah, 6:41 the son of ethni, the son
of zerah, the son of adaiah, 6:42 the son of ethan, the son of zimmah,
th son of shimei, 6:43 the son of jahath, the son of gershom, the son
of levi.

6:44 and their brethren the son of merari stood on the left hand:
ethan the son of kishi, the son of abdi, the son of malluch, 6:45 the
son of hashabiah, the son of amaziah, the son of hilkiah, 6:46 the son
of amzi, the son of bani, the son of shamer, 6:47 the son of mahli,
th son of mushi, the son of merari, the son of levi.

6:48 their brethren also the levit were appoint unto all manner of
servic of the tabernacl of the hous of god.

6:49 but aaron and hi son offer upon the altar of the burnt
offering, and on the altar of incense, and were appoint for all the
work of the place most holy, and to make an aton for israel,
accord to all that mose the servant of god had commanded.

6:50 and these are the son of aaron; eleazar hi son, phineha his
son, abishua hi son, 6:51 bukki hi son, uzzi hi son, zerahiah his
son, 6:52 meraioth hi son, amariah hi son, ahitub hi son, 6:53
zadok hi son, ahimaaz hi son.

6:54 now these are their dwell place throughout their castl in
their coasts, of the son of aaron, of the famili of the kohathites:
for their wa the lot.

6:55 and they gave them hebron in the land of judah, and the suburbs
thereof round about it.

6:56 but the field of the city, and the villag thereof, they gave
to caleb the son of jephunneh.

6:57 and to the son of aaron they gave the citi of judah, namely,
hebron, the citi of refuge, and libnah with her suburbs, and jattir,
and eshtemoa, with their suburbs, 6:58 and hilen with her suburbs,
debir with her suburbs, 6:59 and ashan with her suburbs, and
bethshemesh with her suburbs: 6:60 and out of the tribe of benjamin;
geba with her suburbs, and alemeth with her suburbs, and anathoth with
her suburbs. all their citi throughout their famili were thirteen
cities.

6:61 and unto the son of kohath, which were left of the famili of
that tribe, were citi given out of the half tribe, namely, out of
th half tribe of manasseh, by lot, ten cities.

6:62 and to the son of gershom throughout their famili out of the
trib of issachar, and out of the tribe of asher, and out of the tribe
of naphtali, and out of the tribe of manasseh in bashan, thirteen
cities.

6:63 unto the son of merari were given by lot, throughout their
families, out of the tribe of reuben, and out of the tribe of gad, and
out of the tribe of zebulun, twelv cities.

6:64 and the children of israel gave to the levit these citi with
their suburbs.

6:65 and they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of judah,
and out of the tribe of the children of simeon, and out of the tribe
of the children of benjamin, these cities, which are call by their
names.

6:66 and the residu of the famili of the son of kohath had cities
of their coast out of the tribe of ephraim.

6:67 and they gave unto them, of the citi of refuge, shechem in
mount ephraim with her suburbs; they gave also gezer with her suburbs,
6:68 and jokmeam with her suburbs, and bethhoron with her suburbs,
6:69 and aijalon with her suburbs, and gathrimmon with her suburbs:
6:70 and out of the half tribe of manasseh; aner with her suburbs, and
bileam with her suburbs, for the famili of the remnant of the son of
kohath.

6:71 unto the son of gershom were given out of the famili of the half
trib of manasseh, golan in bashan with her suburbs, and ashtaroth
with her suburbs: 6:72 and out of the tribe of issachar; kedesh with
her suburbs, daberath with her suburbs, 6:73 and ramoth with her
suburbs, and anem with her suburbs: 6:74 and out of the tribe of
asher; mashal with her suburbs, and abdon with her suburbs, 6:75 and
hukok with her suburbs, and rehob with her suburbs: 6:76 and out of
th tribe of naphtali; kedesh in galile with her suburbs, and hammon
with her suburbs, and kirjathaim with her suburbs.

6:77 unto the rest of the children of merari were given out of the
trib of zebulun, rimmon with her suburbs, tabor with her suburbs:
6:78 and on the other side jordan by jericho, on the east side of
jordan, were given them out of the tribe of reuben, bezer in the
wild with her suburbs, and jahzah with her suburbs, 6:79
kedemoth also with her suburbs, and mephaath with her suburbs: 6:80
and out of the tribe of gad; ramoth in gilead with her suburbs, and
mahanaim with her suburbs, 6:81 and heshbon with her suburbs, and
jaz with her suburbs.

7:1 now the son of issachar were, tola, and puah, jashub, and
shimrom, four.

7:2 and the son of tola; uzzi, and rephaiah, and jeriel, and jahmai,
and jibsam, and shemuel, head of their father' house, to wit, of
tola: they were valiant men of might in their generations; whose
numb wa in the day of david two and twenti thousand and six
hundred.

7:3 and the son of uzzi; izrahiah: and the son of izrahiah; michael,
and obadiah, and joel, ishiah, five: all of them chief men.

7:4 and with them, by their generations, after the hous of their
fathers, were band of soldier for war, six and thirti thousand men:
for they had mani wive and sons.

7:5 and their brethren among all the famili of issachar were valiant
men of might, reckon in all by their genealog fourscor and seven
thousand.

7:6 the son of benjamin; bela, and becher, and jediael, three.

7:7 and the son of bela; ezbon, and uzzi, and uzziel, and jerimoth,
and iri, five; head of the hous of their fathers, mighti men of
valour; and were reckon by their genealog twenti and two thousand
and thirti and four.

7:8 and the son of becher; zemira, and joash, and eliezer, and
elioenai, and omri, and jerimoth, and abiah, and anathoth, and
alameth. all these are the son of becher.

7:9 and the number of them, after their genealog by their
generations, head of the hous of their fathers, mighti men of
valour, wa twenti thousand and two hundred.

7:10 the son also of jediael; bilhan: and the son of bilhan; jeush,
and benjamin, and ehud, and chenaanah, and zethan, and tharshish, and
ahishahar.

7:11 all these the son of jediael, by the head of their fathers,
mighti men of valour, were seventeen thousand and two hundred
soldiers, fit to go out for war and battle.

7:12 shuppim also, and huppim, the children of ir, and hushim, the
son of aher.

7:13 the son of naphtali; jahziel, and guni, and jezer, and shallum,
th son of bilhah.

7:14 the son of manasseh; ashriel, whom she bare: (but hi concubine
th aramitess bare machir the father of gilead: 7:15 and machir took
to wife the sister of huppim and shuppim, whose sister' name was
maachah;) and the name of the second wa zelophehad: and zelophehad
had daughters.

7:16 and maachah the wife of machir bare a son, and she call his
nam peresh; and the name of hi brother wa sheresh; and hi sons
wer ulam and rakem.

7:17 and the son of ulam; bedan. these were the son of gilead, the
son of machir, the son of manasseh.

7:18 and hi sister hammoleketh bare ishod, and abiezer, and mahalah.

7:19 and the son of shemidah were, ahian, and shechem, and likhi, and
aniam.

7:20 and the son of ephraim; shuthelah, and bere hi son, and tahath
hi son, and eladah hi son, and tahath hi son, 7:21 and zabad his
son, and shuthelah hi son, and ezer, and elead, whom the men of gath
that were born in that land slew, becaus they came down to take away
their cattle.

7:22 and ephraim their father mourn mani days, and hi brethren came
to comfort him.

7:23 and when he went in to hi wife, she conceived, and bare a son,
and he call hi name beriah, becaus it went evil with hi house.

7:24 (and hi daughter wa sherah, who built bethhoron the nether, and
th upper, and uzzensherah.)  7:25 and rephah wa hi son, also
resheph, and telah hi son, and tahan hi son.

7:26 laadan hi son, ammihud hi son, elishama hi son.

7:27 non hi son, jehoshuah hi son.

7:28 and their possess and habit were, bethel and the towns
thereof, and eastward naaran, and westward gezer, with the towns
thereof; shechem also and the town thereof, unto gaza and the towns
thereof: 7:29 and by the border of the children of manasseh,
bethshean and her towns, taanach and her towns, megiddo and her towns,
dor and her towns. In these dwelt the children of joseph the son of
israel.

7:30 the son of asher; imnah, and isuah, and ishuai, and beriah, and
serah their sister.

7:31 and the son of beriah; heber, and malchiel, who is the father of
birzavith.

7:32 and heber begat japhlet, and shomer, and hotham, and shua their
sister.

7:33 and the son of japhlet; pasach, and bimhal, and ashvath. these
ar the children of japhlet.

7:34 and the son of shamer; ahi, and rohgah, jehubbah, and aram.

7:35 and the son of hi brother helem; zophah, and imna, and shelesh,
and amal.

7:36 the son of zophah; suah, and harnepher, and shual, and beri, and
imrah, 7:37 bezer, and hod, and shamma, and shilshah, and ithran, and
beera.

7:38 and the son of jether; jephunneh, and pispah, and ara.

7:39 and the son of ulla; arah, and haniel, and rezia.

7:40 all these were the children of asher, head of their father's
house, choic and mighti men of valour, chief of the princes. and the
numb throughout the genealog of them that were apt to the war and
to battl wa twenti and six thousand men.

8:1 now benjamin begat bela hi firstborn, ashbel the second, and
aharah the third, 8:2 nohah the fourth, and rapha the fifth.

8:3 and the son of bela were, addar, and gera, and abihud, 8:4 and
abishua, and naaman, and ahoah, 8:5 and gera, and shephuphan, and
huram.

8:6 and these are the son of ehud: these are the head of the fathers
of the inhabit of geba, and they remov them to manahath: 8:7 and
naaman, and ahiah, and gera, he remov them, and begat uzza, and
ahihud.

8:8 and shaharaim begat children in the countri of moab, after he had
sent them away; hushim and baara were hi wives.

8:9 and he begat of hodesh hi wife, jobab, and zibia, and mesha, and
malcham, 8:10 and jeuz, and shachia, and mirma. these were hi sons,
head of the fathers.

8:11 and of hushim he begat abitub, and elpaal.

8:12 the son of elpaal; eber, and misham, and shamed, who built ono,
and lod, with the town thereof: 8:13 beriah also, and shema, who were
head of the father of the inhabit of aijalon, who drove away the
inhabit of gath: 8:14 and ahio, shashak, and jeremoth, 8:15 and
zebadiah, and arad, and ader, 8:16 and michael, and ispah, and joha,
th son of beriah; 8:17 and zebadiah, and meshullam, and hezeki, and
heber, 8:18 ishmerai also, and jezliah, and jobab, the son of elpaal;
8:19 and jakim, and zichri, and zabdi, 8:20 and elienai, and zilthai,
and eliel, 8:21 and adaiah, and beraiah, and shimrath, the son of
shimhi; 8:22 and ishpan, and heber, and eliel, 8:23 and abdon, and
zichri, and hanan, 8:24 and hananiah, and elam, and antothijah, 8:25
and iphedeiah, and penuel, the son of shashak; 8:26 and shamsherai,
and shehariah, and athaliah, 8:27 and jaresiah, and eliah, and zichri,
th son of jeroham.

8:28 these were head of the fathers, by their generations, chief men.

thes dwelt in jerusalem.

8:29 and at gibeon dwelt the father of gibeon; whose wife' name was
maachah: 8:30 and hi firstborn son abdon, and zur, and kish, and
baal, and nadab, 8:31 and gedor, and ahio, and zacher.

8:32 and mikloth begat shimeah. and these also dwelt with their
brethren in jerusalem, over against them.

8:33 and ner begat kish, and kish begat saul, and saul begat jonathan,
and malchishua, and abinadab, and eshbaal.

8:34 and the son of jonathan wa meribbaal; and meribba begat micah.

8:35 and the son of micah were, pithon, and melech, and tarea, and
ahaz.

8:36 and ahaz begat jehoadah; and jehoadah begat alemeth, and
azmaveth, and zimri; and zimri begat moza, 8:37 and moza begat binea:
rapha wa hi son, eleasah hi son, azel hi son: 8:38 and azel had
six sons, whose name are these, azrikam, bocheru, and ishmael, and
sheariah, and obadiah, and hanan. all these were the son of azel.

8:39 and the son of eshek hi brother were, ulam hi firstborn,
jehush the second, and eliphelet the third.

8:40 and the son of ulam were mighti men of valour, archers, and had
mani sons, and sons' sons, an hundr and fifty. all these are of the
son of benjamin.

9:1 So all israel were reckon by genealogies; and, behold, they were
written in the book of the king of israel and judah, who were carried
away to babylon for their transgression.

9:2 now the first inhabit that dwelt in their possess in their
citi were, the israelites, the priests, levites, and the nethinims.

9:3 and in jerusalem dwelt of the children of judah, and of the
children of benjamin, and of the children of ephraim, and manasseh;
9:4 uthai the son of ammihud, the son of omri, the son of imri, the
son of bani, of the children of pharez the son of judah.

9:5 and of the shilonites; asaiah the firstborn, and hi sons.

9:6 and of the son of zerah; jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred
and ninety.

9:7 and of the son of benjamin; sallu the son of meshullam, the son
of hodaviah, the son of hasenuah, 9:8 and ibneiah the son of jeroham,
and elah the son of uzzi, the son of michri, and meshullam the son of
shephathiah, the son of reuel, the son of ibnijah; 9:9 and their
brethren, accord to their generations, nine hundr and fifti and
six. all these men were chief of the father in the hous of their
fathers.

9:10 and of the priests; jedaiah, and jehoiarib, and jachin, 9:11 and
azariah the son of hilkiah, the son of meshullam, the son of zadok,
th son of meraioth, the son of ahitub, the ruler of the hous of god;
9:12 and adaiah the son of jeroham, the son of pashur, the son of
malchijah, and maasiai the son of adiel, the son of jahzerah, the son
of meshullam, the son of meshillemith, the son of immer; 9:13 and
their brethren, head of the hous of their fathers, a thousand and
seven hundr and threescore; veri abl men for the work of the
servic of the hous of god.

9:14 and of the levites; shemaiah the son of hasshub, the son of
azrikam, the son of hashabiah, of the son of merari; 9:15 and
bakbakkar, heresh, and galal, and mattaniah the son of micah, the son
of zichri, the son of asaph; 9:16 and obadiah the son of shemaiah, the
son of galal, the son of jeduthun, and berechiah the son of asa, the
son of elkanah, that dwelt in the villag of the netophathites.

9:17 and the porter were, shallum, and akkub, and talmon, and ahiman,
and their brethren: shallum wa the chief; 9:18 who hitherto wait in
th king' gate eastward: they were porter in the compani of the
children of levi.

9:19 and shallum the son of kore, the son of ebiasaph, the son of
korah, and hi brethren, of the hous of hi father, the korahites,
wer over the work of the service, keeper of the gate of the
tabernacle: and their fathers, be over the host of the lord, were
keep of the entry.

9:20 and phineha the son of eleazar wa the ruler over them in time
past, and the lord wa with him.

9:21 and zechariah the son of meshelemiah wa porter of the door of
th tabernacl of the congregation.

9:22 all these which were chosen to be porter in the gate were two
hundr and twelve. these were reckon by their genealog in their
villages, whom david and samuel the seer did ordain in their set
office.

9:23 So they and their children had the oversight of the gate of the
hous of the lord, namely, the hous of the tabernacle, by wards.

9:24 In four quarter were the porters, toward the east, west, north,
and south.

9:25 and their brethren, which were in their villages, were to come
aft seven day from time to time with them.

9:26 for these levites, the four chief porters, were in their set
office, and were over the chamber and treasuri of the hous of god.

9:27 and they lodg round about the hous of god, becaus the charge
wa upon them, and the open thereof everi morn pertain to
them.

9:28 and certain of them had the charg of the minist vessels,
that they should bring them in and out by tale.

9:29 some of them also were appoint to overse the vessels, and all
th instrument of the sanctuary, and the fine flour, and the wine,
and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.

9:30 and some of the son of the priest made the ointment of the
spices.

9:31 and mattithiah, one of the levites, who wa the firstborn of
shallum the korahite, had the set offic over the thing that were
mad in the pans.

9:32 and other of their brethren, of the son of the kohathites, were
ov the shewbread, to prepar it everi sabbath.

9:33 and these are the singers, chief of the father of the levites,
who remain in the chamber were free: for they were employ in
that work day and night.

9:34 these chief father of the levit were chief throughout their
generations; these dwelt at jerusalem.

9:35 and in gibeon dwelt the father of gibeon, jehiel, whose wife's
nam wa maachah: 9:36 and hi firstborn son abdon, then zur, and
kish, and baal, and ner, and nadab.

9:37 and gedor, and ahio, and zechariah, and mikloth.

9:38 and mikloth begat shimeam. and they also dwelt with their
brethren at jerusalem, over against their brethren.

9:39 and ner begat kish; and kish begat saul; and saul begat jonathan,
and malchishua, and abinadab, and eshbaal.

9:40 and the son of jonathan wa meribbaal: and meribba begat micah.

9:41 and the son of micah were, pithon, and melech, and tahrea, and
ahaz.

9:42 and ahaz begat jarah; and jarah begat alemeth, and azmaveth, and
zimri; and zimri begat moza; 9:43 and moza begat binea; and rephaiah
hi son, eleasah hi son, azel hi son.

9:44 and azel had six sons, whose name are these, azrikam, bocheru,
and ishmael, and sheariah, and obadiah, and hanan: these were the sons
of azel.

10:1 now the philistin fought against israel; and the men of israel
fl from befor the philistines, and fell down slain in mount gilboa.

10:2 and the philistin follow hard after saul, and after hi sons;
and the philistin slew jonathan, and abinadab, and malchishua, the
son of saul.

10:3 and the battl went sore against saul, and the archer hit him,
and he wa wound of the archers.

10:4 then said saul to hi armourbearer, draw thi sword, and thrust me
through therewith; lest these uncircumcis come and abus me. but his
armourbear would not; for he wa sore afraid. So saul took a sword,
and fell upon it.

10:5 and when hi armourbear saw that saul wa dead, he fell
likewis on the sword, and died.

10:6 So saul died, and hi three sons, and all hi hous died
together.

10:7 and when all the men of israel that were in the valley saw that
they fled, and that saul and hi son were dead, then they forsook
their cities, and fled: and the philistin came and dwelt in them.

10:8 and it came to pass on the morrow, when the philistin came to
strip the slain, that they found saul and hi son fallen in mount
gilboa.

10:9 and when they had strip him, they took hi head, and his
armour, and sent into the land of the philistin round about, to
carri tide unto their idols, and to the people.

10:10 and they put hi armour in the hous of their gods, and fastened
hi head in the templ of dagon.

10:11 and when all jabeshgilead heard all that the philistin had
don to saul, 10:12 they arose, all the valiant men, and took away the
bodi of saul, and the bodi of hi sons, and brought them to jabesh,
and buri their bone under the oak in jabesh, and fast seven days.

10:13 So saul die for hi transgress which he commit against
th lord, even against the word of the lord, which he kept not, and
also for ask counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to enquire
of it; 10:14 and enquir not of the lord: therefor he slew him, and
turn the kingdom unto david the son of jesse.

11:1 then all israel gather themselv to david unto hebron, saying,
behold, we are thi bone and thi flesh.

11:2 and moreov in time past, even when saul wa king, thou wast he
that leddest out and broughtest in israel: and the lord thi god said
unto thee, thou shalt feed my peopl israel, and thou shalt be ruler
ov my peopl israel.

11:3 therefor came all the elder of israel to the king to hebron;
and david made a coven with them in hebron befor the lord; and
they anoint david king over israel, accord to the word of the
lord by samuel.

11:4 and david and all israel went to jerusalem, which is jebus; where
th jebusit were, the inhabit of the land.

11:5 and the inhabit of jebu said to david, thou shalt not come
hither. nevertheless david took the castl of zion, which is the city
of david.

11:6 and david said, whosoev smiteth the jebusit first shall be
chief and captain. So joab the son of zeruiah went first up, and was
chief.

11:7 and david dwelt in the castle; therefor they call it the city
of david.

11:8 and he built the citi round about, even from millo round about:
and joab repair the rest of the city.

11:9 So david wax greater and greater: for the lord of host was
with him.

11:10 these also are the chief of the mighti men whom david had, who
strengthen themselv with him in hi kingdom, and with all israel,
to make him king, accord to the word of the lord concern israel.

11:11 and thi is the number of the mighti men whom david had;
jashobeam, an hachmonite, the chief of the captains: he lift up his
spear against three hundr slain by him at one time.

11:12 and after him wa eleazar the son of dodo, the ahohite, who was
on of the three mighties.

11:13 He wa with david at pasdammim, and there the philistin were
gath togeth to battle, where wa a parcel of ground full of
barley; and the peopl fled from befor the philistines.

11:14 and they set themselv in the midst of that parcel, and
deliv it, and slew the philistines; and the lord save them by a
great deliverance.

11:15 now three of the thirti captain went down to the rock to david,
into the cave of adullam; and the host of the philistin encamp in
th valley of rephaim.

11:16 and david wa then in the hold, and the philistines' garrison
wa then at bethlehem.

11:17 and david longed, and said, Oh that one would give me drink of
th water of the well of bethlehem, that is at the gate!  11:18 and
th three brake through the host of the philistines, and drew water
out of the well of bethlehem, that wa by the gate, and took it, and
brought it to david: but david would not drink of it, but pour it
out to the lord.

11:19 and said, My god forbid it me, that I should do thi thing:
shal I drink the blood of these men that have put their live in
jeopardy? for with the jeopardi of their live they brought it.
therefor he would not drink it.

thes thing did these three mightiest.

11:20 and abishai the brother of joab, he wa chief of the three: for
lift up hi spear against three hundred, he slew them, and had a
nam among the three.

11:21 Of the three, he wa more honour than the two; for he was
their captain: howbeit he attain not to the first three.

11:22 benaiah the son of jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of
kabzeel, who had done mani acts; he slew two lionlik men of moab:
also he went down and slew a lion in a pit in a snowi day.

11:23 and he slew an egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits
high; and in the egyptian' hand wa a spear like a weaver' beam; and
h went down to him with a staff, and pluck the spear out of the
egyptian' hand, and slew him with hi own spear.

11:24 these thing did benaiah the son of jehoiada, and had the name
among the three mighties.

11:25 behold, he wa honour among the thirty, but attain not to
th first three: and david set him over hi guard.

11:26 also the valiant men of the armi were, asahel the brother of
joab, elhanan the son of dodo of bethlehem, 11:27 shammoth the
harorite, helez the pelonite, 11:28 ira the son of ikkesh the tekoite,
abiez the antothite, 11:29 sibbecai the hushathite, ilai the
ahohite, 11:30 maharai the netophathite, hele the son of baanah the
netophathite, 11:31 ithai the son of ribai of gibeah, that pertained
to the children of benjamin, benaiah the pirathonite, 11:32 hurai of
th brook of gaash, abiel the arbathite, 11:33 azmaveth the
baharumite, eliahba the shaalbonite, 11:34 the son of hashem the
gizonite, jonathan the son of shage the hararite, 11:35 ahiam the son
of sacar the hararite, eliph the son of ur, 11:36 hepher the
mecherathite, ahijah the pelonite, 11:37 hezro the carmelite, naarai
th son of ezbai, 11:38 joel the brother of nathan, mibhar the son of
haggeri, 11:39 zelek the ammonite, naharai the berothite, the
armourbear of joab the son of zeruiah, 11:40 ira the ithrite, gareb
th ithrite, 11:41 uriah the hittite, zabad the son of ahlai, 11:42
adina the son of shiza the reubenite, a captain of the reubenites, and
thirti with him, 11:43 hanan the son of maachah, and joshaphat the
mithnite, 11:44 uzzia the ashterathite, shama and jehiel the son of
hothan the aroerite, 11:45 jediael the son of shimri, and joha his
brother, the tizite, 11:46 eliel the mahavite, and jeribai, and
joshaviah, the son of elnaam, and ithmah the moabite, 11:47 eliel,
and obed, and jasiel the mesobaite.

12:1 now these are they that came to david to ziklag, while he yet
kept himself close becaus of saul the son of kish: and they were
among the mighti men, helper of the war.

12:2 they were arm with bows, and could use both the right hand and
th left in hurl stone and shoot arrow out of a bow, even of
saul' brethren of benjamin.

12:3 the chief wa ahiezer, then joash, the son of shemaah the
gibeathite; and jeziel, and pelet, the son of azmaveth; and berachah,
and jehu the antothite.

12:4 and ismaiah the gibeonite, a mighti man among the thirty, and
ov the thirty; and jeremiah, and jahaziel, and johanan, and josabad
th gederathite, 12:5 eluzai, and jerimoth, and bealiah, and
shemariah, and shephatiah the haruphite, 12:6 elkanah, and jesiah, and
azareel, and joezer, and jashobeam, the korhites, 12:7 and joelah, and
zebadiah, the son of jeroham of gedor.

12:8 and of the gadit there separ themselv unto david into the
hold to the wilder men of might, and men of war fit for the
battle, that could handl shield and buckler, whose face were like
th face of lions, and were as swift as the roe upon the mountains;
12:9 ezer the first, obadiah the second, eliab the third, 12:10
mishmannah the fourth, jeremiah the fifth, 12:11 attai the sixth,
eliel the seventh, 12:12 johanan the eighth, elzabad the ninth, 12:13
jeremiah the tenth, machbanai the eleventh.

12:14 these were of the son of gad, captain of the host: one of the
least wa over an hundred, and the greatest over a thousand.

12:15 these are they that went over jordan in the first month, when it
had overflown all hi banks; and they put to flight all them of the
valleys, both toward the east, and toward the west.

12:16 and there came of the children of benjamin and judah to the hold
unto david.

12:17 and david went out to meet them, and answer and said unto
them, If ye be come peaceabl unto me to help me, mine heart shall be
knit unto you: but if ye be come to betray me to mine enemies, seeing
ther is no wrong in mine hands, the god of our father look thereon,
and rebuk it.

12:18 then the spirit came upon amasai, who wa chief of the captains,
and he said, thine are we, david, and on thi side, thou son of jesse:
peace, peac be unto thee, and peac be to thine helpers; for thi god
helpeth thee.

then david receiv them, and made them captain of the band.

12:19 and there fell some of manasseh to david, when he came with the
philistin against saul to battle: but they help them not: for the
lord of the philistin upon advis sent him away, saying, he
wil fall to hi master saul to the jeopardi of our heads.

12:20 As he went to ziklag, there fell to him of manasseh, adnah, and
jozabad, and jediael, and michael, and jozabad, and elihu, and
zilthai, captain of the thousand that were of manasseh.

12:21 and they help david against the band of the rovers: for they
wer all mighti men of valour, and were captain in the host.

12:22 for at that time day by day there came to david to help him,
until it wa a great host, like the host of god.

12:23 and these are the number of the band that were readi arm to
th war, and came to david to hebron, to turn the kingdom of saul to
him, accord to the word of the lord.

12:24 the children of judah that bare shield and spear were six
thousand and eight hundred, readi arm to the war.

12:25 Of the children of simeon, mighti men of valour for the war,
seven thousand and one hundred.

12:26 Of the children of levi four thousand and six hundred.

12:27 and jehoiada wa the leader of the aaronites, and with him were
thre thousand and seven hundred; 12:28 and zadok, a young man mighty
of valour, and of hi father' hous twenti and two captains.

12:29 and of the children of benjamin, the kindr of saul, three
thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kept the ward of
th hous of saul.

12:30 and of the children of ephraim twenti thousand and eight
hundred, mighti men of valour, famou throughout the hous of their
fathers.

12:31 and of the half tribe of manasseh eighteen thousand, which were
express by name, to come and make david king.

12:32 and of the children of issachar, which were men that had
understand of the times, to know what israel ought to do; the heads
of them were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their
commandment.

12:33 Of zebulun, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, with
al instrument of war, fifti thousand, which could keep rank: they
wer not of doubl heart.

12:34 and of naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield
and spear thirti and seven thousand.

12:35 and of the danit expert in war twenti and eight thousand and
six hundred.

12:36 and of asher, such as went forth to battle, expert in war, forty
thousand.

12:37 and on the other side of jordan, of the reubenites, and the
gadites, and of the half tribe of manasseh, with all manner of
instru of war for the battle, an hundr and twenti thousand.

12:38 all these men of war, that could keep rank, came with a perfect
heart to hebron, to make david king over all israel: and all the rest
also of israel were of one heart to make david king.

12:39 and there they were with david three days, eat and drinking:
for their brethren had prepar for them.

12:40 moreov they that were nigh them, even unto issachar and
zebulun and naphtali, brought bread on asses, and on camels, and on
mules, and on oxen, and meat, meal, cake of figs, and bunch of
raisins, and wine, and oil, and oxen, and sheep abundantly: for there
wa joy in israel.

13:1 and david consult with the captain of thousand and hundreds,
and with everi leader.

13:2 and david said unto all the congreg of israel, If it seem
good unto you, and that it be of the lord our god, let us send abroad
unto our brethren everi where, that are left in all the land of
israel, and with them also to the priest and levit which are in
their citi and suburbs, that they may gather themselv unto us:
13:3 and let us bring again the ark of our god to us: for we enquired
not at it in the day of saul.

13:4 and all the congreg said that they would do so: for the
th wa right in the eye of all the people.

13:5 So david gather all israel together, from shihor of egypt even
unto the enter of hemath, to bring the ark of god from
kirjathjearim.

13:6 and david went up, and all israel, to baalah, that is, to
kirjathjearim, which belong to judah, to bring up thenc the ark of
god the lord, that dwelleth between the cherubims, whose name is
cal on it.

13:7 and they carri the ark of god in a new cart out of the hous of
abinadab: and uzza and ahio drave the cart.

13:8 and david and all israel play befor god with all their might,
and with singing, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with
timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.

13:9 and when they came unto the threshingfloor of chidon, uzza put
forth hi hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.

13:10 and the anger of the lord wa kindl against uzza, and he smote
him, becaus he put hi hand to the ark: and there he die befor god.

13:11 and david wa displeased, becaus the lord had made a breach
upon uzza: wherefor that place is call perezuzza to thi day.

13:12 and david wa afraid of god that day, saying, how shall I bring
th ark of god home to me?  13:13 So david brought not the ark home to
himself to the citi of david, but carri it asid into the hous of
obededom the gittite.

13:14 and the ark of god remain with the famili of obededom in his
hous three months. and the lord bless the hous of obededom, and
al that he had.

14:1 now hiram king of tyre sent messeng to david, and timber of
cedars, with mason and carpenters, to build him an house.

14:2 and david perceiv that the lord had confirm him king over
israel, for hi kingdom wa lift up on high, becaus of hi people
israel.

14:3 and david took more wive at jerusalem: and david begat more sons
and daughters.

14:4 now these are the name of hi children which he had in
jerusalem; shammua, and shobab, nathan, and solomon, 14:5 and ibhar,
and elishua, and elpalet, 14:6 and nogah, and nepheg, and japhia, 14:7
and elishama, and beeliada, and eliphalet.

14:8 and when the philistin heard that david wa anoint king over
al israel, all the philistin went up to seek david. and david heard
of it, and went out against them.

14:9 and the philistin came and spread themselv in the valley of
rephaim.

14:10 and david enquir of god, saying, shall I go up against the
philistines? and wilt thou deliv them into mine hand? and the lord
said unto him, Go up; for I will deliv them into thine hand.

14:11 So they came up to baalperazim; and david smote them there. then
david said, god hath broken in upon mine enemi by mine hand like the
break forth of waters: therefor they call the name of that place
baalperazim.

14:12 and when they had left their god there, david gave a
commandment, and they were burn with fire.

14:13 and the philistin yet again spread themselv abroad in the
valley.

14:14 therefor david enquir again of god; and god said unto him, go
not up after them; turn away from them, and come upon them over
against the mulberri trees.

14:15 and it shall be, when thou shalt hear a sound of go in the
top of the mulberri trees, that then thou shalt go out to battle: for
god is gone forth befor thee to smite the host of the philistines.

14:16 david therefor did as god command him: and they smote the
host of the philistin from gibeon even to gazer.

14:17 and the fame of david went out into all lands; and the lord
brought the fear of him upon all nations.

15:1 and david made him hous in the citi of david, and prepar a
plac for the ark of god, and pitch for it a tent.

15:2 then david said, none ought to carri the ark of god but the
levites: for them hath the lord chosen to carri the ark of god, and to
minist unto him for ever.

15:3 and david gather all israel togeth to jerusalem, to bring up
th ark of the lord unto hi place, which he had prepar for it.

15:4 and david assembl the children of aaron, and the levites: 15:5
of the son of kohath; uriel the chief, and hi brethren an hundred
and twenty: 15:6 Of the son of merari; asaiah the chief, and his
brethren two hundr and twenty: 15:7 Of the son of gershom; joel the
chief and hi brethren an hundr and thirty: 15:8 Of the son of
elizaphan; shemaiah the chief, and hi brethren two hundred: 15:9 of
th son of hebron; eliel the chief, and hi brethren fourscore: 15:10
of the son of uzziel; amminadab the chief, and hi brethren an
hundr and twelve.

15:11 and david call for zadok and abiathar the priests, and for the
levites, for uriel, asaiah, and joel, shemaiah, and eliel, and
amminadab, 15:12 and said unto them, Ye are the chief of the fathers
of the levites: sanctifi yourselves, both ye and your brethren, that
y may bring up the ark of the lord god of israel unto the place that
i have prepar for it.

15:13 for becaus ye did it not at the first, the lord our god made a
breach upon us, for that we sought him not after the due order.

15:14 So the priest and the levit sanctifi themselv to bring up
th ark of the lord god of israel.

15:15 and the children of the levit bare the ark of god upon their
should with the stave thereon, as mose command accord to the
word of the lord.

15:16 and david spake to the chief of the levit to appoint their
brethren to be the singer with instrument of musick, psalteri and
harp and cymbals, sounding, by lift up the voic with joy.

15:17 So the levit appoint heman the son of joel; and of his
brethren, asaph the son of berechiah; and of the son of merari their
brethren, ethan the son of kushaiah; 15:18 and with them their
brethren of the second degree, zechariah, ben, and jaaziel, and
shemiramoth, and jehiel, and unni, eliab, and benaiah, and maaseiah,
and mattithiah, and elipheleh, and mikneiah, and obededom, and jeiel,
th porters.

15:19 So the singers, heman, asaph, and ethan, were appoint to sound
with cymbal of brass; 15:20 and zechariah, and aziel, and
shemiramoth, and jehiel, and unni, and eliab, and maaseiah, and
benaiah, with psalteri on alamoth; 15:21 and mattithiah, and
elipheleh, and mikneiah, and obededom, and jeiel, and azaziah, with
harp on the sheminith to excel.

15:22 and chenaniah, chief of the levites, wa for song: he instructed
about the song, becaus he wa skilful.

15:23 and berechiah and elkanah were doorkeep for the ark.

15:24 and shebaniah, and jehoshaphat, and nethaneel, and amasai, and
zechariah, and benaiah, and eliezer, the priests, did blow with the
trumpet befor the ark of god: and obededom and jehiah were
doorkeep for the ark.

15:25 So david, and the elder of israel, and the captain over
thousands, went to bring up the ark of the coven of the lord out of
th hous of obededom with joy.

15:26 and it came to pass, when god help the levit that bare the
ark of the coven of the lord, that they offer seven bullock and
seven rams.

15:27 and david wa cloth with a robe of fine linen, and all the
levit that bare the ark, and the singers, and chenaniah the master
of the song with the singers: david also had upon him an ephod of
linen.

15:28 thu all israel brought up the ark of the coven of the lord
with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and with trumpets, and
with cymbals, make a nois with psalteri and harps.

15:29 and it came to pass, as the ark of the coven of the lord came
to the citi of david, that michal, the daughter of saul look out at
a window saw king david danc and playing: and she despis him in
her heart.

16:1 So they brought the ark of god, and set it in the midst of the
tent that david had pitch for it: and they offer burnt sacrifices
and peac offer befor god.

16:2 and when david had made an end of offer the burnt offerings
and the peac offerings, he bless the peopl in the name of the
lord.

16:3 and he dealt to everi one of israel, both man and woman, to every
on a loaf of bread, and a good piec of flesh, and a flagon of wine.

16:4 and he appoint certain of the levit to minist befor the
ark of the lord, and to record, and to thank and prais the lord god
of israel: 16:5 asaph the chief, and next to him zechariah, jeiel, and
shemiramoth, and jehiel, and mattithiah, and eliab, and benaiah, and
obededom: and jeiel with psalteri and with harps; but asaph made a
sound with cymbals; 16:6 benaiah also and jahaziel the priest with
trumpet continu befor the ark of the coven of god.

16:7 then on that day david deliv first thi psalm to thank the
lord into the hand of asaph and hi brethren.

16:8 give thank unto the lord, call upon hi name, make known his
de among the people.

16:9 sing unto him, sing psalm unto him, talk ye of all hi wondrous
works.

16:10 glori ye in hi holi name: let the heart of them rejoic that
seek the lord.

16:11 seek the lord and hi strength, seek hi face continually.

16:12 rememb hi marvel work that he hath done, hi wonders,
and the judgment of hi mouth; 16:13 O ye seed of israel hi servant,
y children of jacob, hi chosen ones.

16:14 He is the lord our god; hi judgment are in all the earth.

16:15 Be ye mind alway of hi covenant; the word which he
command to a thousand generations; 16:16 even of the coven which
h made with abraham, and of hi oath unto isaac; 16:17 and hath
confirm the same to jacob for a law, and to israel for an
everlast covenant, 16:18 saying, unto thee will I give the land of
canaan, the lot of your inheritance; 16:19 when ye were but few, even
a few, and stranger in it.

16:20 and when they went from nation to nation, and from one kingdom
to anoth people; 16:21 He suffer no man to do them wrong: yea, he
reprov king for their sakes, 16:22 saying, touch not mine anointed,
and do my prophet no harm.

16:23 sing unto the lord, all the earth; shew forth from day to day
hi salvation.

16:24 declar hi glori among the heathen; hi marvel work among
al nations.

16:25 for great is the lord, and greatli to be praised: he also is to
b fear abov all gods.

16:26 for all the god of the peopl are idols: but the lord made the
heavens.

16:27 glori and honour are in hi presence; strength and glad are
in hi place.

16:28 give unto the lord, ye kindr of the people, give unto the
lord glori and strength.

16:29 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name: bring an
offering, and come befor him: worship the lord in the beauti of
holiness.

16:30 fear befor him, all the earth: the world also shall be stable,
that it be not moved.

16:31 let the heaven be glad, and let the earth rejoice: and let men
say among the nations, the lord reigneth.

16:32 let the sea roar, and the ful thereof: let the fields
rejoice, and all that is therein.

16:33 then shall the tree of the wood sing out at the presenc of the
lord, becaus he cometh to judg the earth.

16:34 O give thank unto the lord; for he is good; for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

16:35 and say ye, save us, O god of our salvation, and gather us
together, and deliv us from the heathen, that we may give thank to
thi holi name, and glori in thi praise.

16:36 bless be the lord god of israel for ever and ever. and all the
peopl said, amen, and prais the lord.

16:37 So he left there befor the ark of the coven of the lord
asaph and hi brethren, to minist befor the ark continually, as
everi day' work required: 16:38 and obededom with their brethren,
threescor and eight; obededom also the son of jeduthun and hosah to
b porters: 16:39 and zadok the priest, and hi brethren the priests,
befor the tabernacl of the lord in the high place that wa at
gibeon, 16:40 To offer burnt offer unto the lord upon the altar of
th burnt offer continu morn and evening, and to do
accord to all that is written in the law of the lord, which he
command israel; 16:41 and with them heman and jeduthun, and the rest
that were chosen, who were express by name, to give thank to the
lord, becaus hi merci endureth for ever; 16:42 and with them heman
and jeduthun with trumpet and cymbal for those that should make a
sound, and with music instrument of god. and the son of jeduthun
wer porters.

16:43 and all the peopl depart everi man to hi house: and david
return to bless hi house.

17:1 now it came to pass, as david sat in hi house, that david said
to nathan the prophet, lo, I dwell in an hous of cedars, but the ark
of the coven of the lord remaineth under curtains.

17:2 then nathan said unto david, Do all that is in thine heart; for
god is with thee.

17:3 and it came to pass the same night, that the word of god came to
nathan, saying, 17:4 Go and tell david my servant, thu saith the
lord, thou shalt not build me an hous to dwell in: 17:5 for I have
not dwelt in an hous sinc the day that I brought up israel unto this
day; but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tabernacl to
another.

17:6 wheresoev I have walk with all israel, spake I a word to any
of the judg of israel, whom I command to feed my people, saying,
whi have ye not built me an hous of cedars?  17:7 now therefor thus
shalt thou say unto my servant david, thu saith the lord of hosts, i
took thee from the sheepcote, even from follow the sheep, that thou
shouldest be ruler over my peopl israel: 17:8 and I have been with
the whithersoev thou hast walked, and have cut off all thine
enemi from befor thee, and have made thee a name like the name of
th great men that are in the earth.

17:9 also I will ordain a place for my peopl israel, and will plant
them, and they shall dwell in their place, and shall be move no more;
neith shall the children of wicked wast them ani more, as at
th beginning, 17:10 and sinc the time that I command judg to be
ov my peopl israel. moreov I will subdu all thine enemies.
furthermor I tell thee that the lord will build thee an house.

17:11 and it shall come to pass, when thi day be expir that thou
must go to be with thi fathers, that I will rais up thi seed after
thee, which shall be of thi sons; and I will establish hi kingdom.

17:12 He shall build me an house, and I will stablish hi throne for
ever.

17:13 I will be hi father, and he shall be my son: and I will not
tak my merci away from him, as I took it from him that wa before
thee: 17:14 but I will settl him in mine hous and in my kingdom for
ever: and hi throne shall be establish for evermore.

17:15 accord to all these words, and accord to all thi vision,
so did nathan speak unto david.

17:16 and david the king came and sat befor the lord, and said, who
am I, O lord god, and what is mine house, that thou hast brought me
hitherto?  17:17 and yet thi wa a small thing in thine eyes, O god;
for thou hast also spoken of thi servant' hous for a great while to
come, and hast regard me accord to the estat of a man of high
degree, O lord god.

17:18 what can david speak more to thee for the honour of thi servant?
for thou knowest thi servant.

17:19 O lord, for thi servant' sake, and accord to thine own
heart, hast thou done all thi greatness, in make known all these
great things.

17:20 O lord, there is none like thee, neither is there ani god beside
thee, accord to all that we have heard with our ears.

17:21 and what one nation in the earth is like thi peopl israel, whom
god went to redeem to be hi own people, to make thee a name of
great and terribleness, by drive out nation from befor thy
peopl whom thou hast redeem out of egypt?  17:22 for thi people
israel didst thou make thine own peopl for ever; and thou, lord,
becamest their god.

17:23 therefor now, lord, let the thing that thou hast spoken
concern thi servant and concern hi hous be establish for
ever, and do as thou hast said.

17:24 let it even be established, that thi name may be magnifi for
ever, saying, the lord of host is the god of israel, even a god to
israel: and let the hous of david thi servant be establish before
thee.

17:25 for thou, O my god, hast told thi servant that thou wilt build
him an house: therefor thi servant hath found in hi heart to pray
befor thee.

17:26 and now, lord, thou art god, and hast promis thi goodness
unto thi servant: 17:27 now therefor let it pleas thee to bless the
hous of thi servant, that it may be befor thee for ever: for thou
blessest, O lord, and it shall be bless for ever.

18:1 now after thi it came to pass, that david smote the philistines,
and subdu them, and took gath and her town out of the hand of the
philistines.

18:2 and he smote moab; and the moabit becam david' servants, and
brought gifts.

18:3 and david smote hadarez king of zobah unto hamath, as he went
to stablish hi dominion by the river euphrates.

18:4 and david took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand
horsemen, and twenti thousand footmen: david also hough all the
chariot horses, but reserv of them an hundr chariots.

18:5 and when the syrian of damascu came to help hadarez king of
zobah, david slew of the syrian two and twenti thousand men.

18:6 then david put garrison in syriadamascus; and the syrian became
david' servants, and brought gifts. thu the lord preserv david
whithersoev he went.

18:7 and david took the shield of gold that were on the servant of
hadarezer, and brought them to jerusalem.

18:8 likewis from tibhath, and from chun, citi of hadarezer,
brought david veri much brass, wherewith solomon made the brasen sea,
and the pillars, and the vessel of brass.

18:9 now when tou king of hamath heard how david had smitten all the
host of hadarez king of zobah; 18:10 He sent hadoram hi son to king
david, to enquir of hi welfare, and to congratul him, becaus he
had fought against hadarezer, and smitten him; (for hadarez had war
with tou;) and with him all manner of vessel of gold and silver and
brass.

18:11 them also king david dedic unto the lord, with the silver
and the gold that he brought from all these nations; from edom, and
from moab, and from the children of ammon, and from the philistines,
and from amalek.

18:12 moreov abishai the son of zeruiah slew of the edomit in the
valley of salt eighteen thousand.

18:13 and he put garrison in edom; and all the edomit became
david' servants. thu the lord preserv david whithersoev he went.

18:14 So david reign over all israel, and execut judgment and
justic among all hi people.

18:15 and joab the son of zeruiah wa over the host; and jehoshaphat
th son of ahilud, recorder.

18:16 and zadok the son of ahitub, and abimelech the son of abiathar,
wer the priests; and shavsha wa scribe; 18:17 and benaiah the son of
jehoiada wa over the cherethit and the pelethites; and the son of
david were chief about the king.

19:1 now it came to pass after this, that nahash the king of the
children of ammon died, and hi son reign in hi stead.

19:2 and david said, I will shew kind unto hanun the son of
nahash, becaus hi father shew kind to me. and david sent
messeng to comfort him concern hi father. So the servant of
david came into the land of the children of ammon to hanun, to comfort
him.

19:3 but the princ of the children of ammon said to hanun, thinkest
th that david doth honour thi father, that he hath sent comforters
unto thee?  are not hi servant come unto thee for to search, and to
overthrow, and to spi out the land?  19:4 wherefor hanun took david's
servants, and shave them, and cut off their garment in the midst
hard by their buttocks, and sent them away.

19:5 then there went certain, and told david how the men were served.
and he sent to meet them: for the men were greatli ashamed. and the
k said, tarri at jericho until your beard be grown, and then
return.

19:6 and when the children of ammon saw that they had made themselves
odi to david, hanun and the children of ammon sent a thousand
tal of silver to hire them chariot and horsemen out of
mesopotamia, and out of syriamaachah, and out of zobah.

19:7 So they hire thirti and two thousand chariots, and the king of
maachah and hi people; who came and pitch befor medeba. and the
children of ammon gather themselv togeth from their cities, and
cam to battle.
