19:8 and when david heard of it, he sent joab, and all the host of the
mighti men.

19:9 and the children of ammon came out, and put the battl in array
befor the gate of the city: and the king that were come were by
themselv in the field.

19:10 now when joab saw that the battl wa set against him befor and
behind, he chose out of all the choic of israel, and put them in
array against the syrians.

19:11 and the rest of the peopl he deliv unto the hand of abishai
hi brother, and they set themselv in array against the children of
ammon.

19:12 and he said, If the syrian be too strong for me, then thou
shalt help me: but if the children of ammon be too strong for thee,
then I will help thee.

19:13 Be of good courage, and let us behav ourselv valiantli for
our people, and for the citi of our god: and let the lord do that
which is good in hi sight.

19:14 So joab and the peopl that were with him drew nigh befor the
syrian unto the battle; and they fled befor him.

19:15 and when the children of ammon saw that the syrian were fled,
they likewis fled befor abishai hi brother, and enter into the
city. then joab came to jerusalem.

19:16 and when the syrian saw that they were put to the wors before
israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the syrian that were
beyond the river: and shophach the captain of the host of hadarezer
w befor them.

19:17 and it wa told david; and he gather all israel, and passed
ov jordan, and came upon them, and set the battl in array against
them. So when david had put the battl in array against the syrians,
they fought with him.

19:18 but the syrian fled befor israel; and david slew of the
syrian seven thousand men which fought in chariots, and forty
thousand footmen, and kill shophach the captain of the host.

19:19 and when the servant of hadarez saw that they were put to the
wors befor israel, they made peac with david, and becam his
servants: neither would the syrian help the children of ammon any
more.

20:1 and it came to pass, that after the year wa expired, at the time
that king go out to battle, joab led forth the power of the army, and
wast the countri of the children of ammon, and came and besieged
rabbah. but david tarri at jerusalem. and joab smote rabbah, and
destroy it.

20:2 and david took the crown of their king from off hi head, and
found it to weigh a talent of gold, and there were preciou stone in
it; and it wa set upon david' head: and he brought also exceeding
much spoil out of the city.

20:3 and he brought out the peopl that were in it, and cut them with
saws, and with harrow of iron, and with axes. even so dealt david
with all the citi of the children of ammon. and david and all the
peopl return to jerusalem.

20:4 and it came to pass after this, that there aros war at gezer
with the philistines; at which time sibbechai the hushathit slew
sippai, that wa of the children of the giant: and they were subdued.

20:5 and there wa war again with the philistines; and elhanan the son
of jair slew lahmi the brother of goliath the gittite, whose spear
staff wa like a weaver' beam.

20:6 and yet again there wa war at gath, where wa a man of great
stature, whose finger and toe were four and twenty, six on each
hand, and six on each foot and he also wa the son of the giant.

20:7 but when he defi israel, jonathan the son of shimea david's
broth slew him.

20:8 these were born unto the giant in gath; and they fell by the hand
of david, and by the hand of hi servants.

21:1 and satan stood up against israel, and provok david to number
israel.

21:2 and david said to joab and to the ruler of the people, go,
numb israel from beersheba even to dan; and bring the number of them
to me, that I may know it.

21:3 and joab answered, the lord make hi peopl an hundr time so
mani more as they be: but, my lord the king, are they not all my
lord' servants?  whi then doth my lord requir thi thing? whi will
h be a caus of trespass to israel?  21:4 nevertheless the king's
word prevail against joab. wherefor joab departed, and went
throughout all israel, and came to jerusalem.

21:5 and joab gave the sum of the number of the peopl unto david. and
al they of israel were a thousand thousand and an hundr thousand
men that drew sword: and judah wa four hundr threescor and ten
thousand men that drew sword.

21:6 but levi and benjamin count he not among them: for the king's
word wa abomin to joab.

21:7 and god wa displeas with thi thing; therefor he smote
israel.

21:8 and david said unto god, I have sin greatly, becaus I have
don thi thing: but now, I beseech thee, do away the iniqu of thy
servant; for I have done veri foolishly.

21:9 and the lord spake unto gad, david' seer, saying, 21:10 Go and
tel david, saying, thu saith the lord, I offer thee three things:
choos thee one of them, that I may do it unto thee.

21:11 So gad came to david, and said unto him, thu saith the lord,
choos thee 21:12 either three years' famine; or three month to be
destroy befor thi foes, while that the sword of thine enemies
overtaketh thee; or els three day the sword of the lord, even the
pestilence, in the land, and the angel of the lord destroying
throughout all the coast of israel. now therefor advis thyself what
word I shall bring again to him that sent me.

21:13 and david said unto gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall now
into the hand of the lord; for veri great are hi mercies: but let me
not fall into the hand of man.

21:14 So the lord sent pestil upon israel: and there fell of
israel seventi thousand men.

21:15 and god sent an angel unto jerusalem to destroy it: and as he
wa destroying, the lord beheld, and he repent him of the evil, and
said to the angel that destroyed, It is enough, stay now thine hand.
and the angel of the lord stood by the threshingfloor of ornan the
jebusite.

21:16 and david lift up hi eyes, and saw the angel of the lord
stand between the earth and the heaven, have a drawn sword in his
hand stretch out over jerusalem. then david and the elder of
israel, who were cloth in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.

21:17 and david said unto god, Is it not I that command the people
to be numbered? even I it is that have sin and done evil indeed;
but as for these sheep, what have they done? let thine hand, I pray
thee, O lord my god, be on me, and on my father' house; but not on
thi people, that they should be plagued.

21:18 then the angel of the lord command gad to say to david, that
david should go up, and set up an altar unto the lord in the
threshingfloor of ornan the jebusite.

21:19 and david went up at the say of gad, which he spake in the
nam of the lord.

21:20 and ornan turn back, and saw the angel; and hi four son with
him hid themselves. now ornan wa thresh wheat.

21:21 and as david came to ornan, ornan look and saw david, and went
out of the threshingfloor, and bow himself to david with hi face to
th ground.

21:22 then david said to ornan, grant me the place of this
threshingfloor, that I may build an altar therein unto the lord: thou
shalt grant it me for the full price: that the plagu may be stayed
from the people.

21:23 and ornan said unto david, take it to thee, and let my lord the
k do that which is good in hi eyes: lo, I give thee the oxen also
for burnt offerings, and the thresh instrument for wood, and the
wheat for the meat offering; I give it all.

21:24 and king david said to ornan, nay; but I will verili buy it for
th full price: for I will not take that which is thine for the lord,
nor offer burnt offer without cost.

21:25 So david gave to ornan for the place six hundr shekel of gold
bi weight.

21:26 and david built there an altar unto the lord, and offer burnt
off and peac offerings, and call upon the lord; and he
answ him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt offering.

21:27 and the lord command the angel; and he put up hi sword again
into the sheath thereof.

21:28 At that time when david saw that the lord had answer him in
th threshingfloor of ornan the jebusite, then he sacrif there.

21:29 for the tabernacl of the lord, which mose made in the
wilderness, and the altar of the burnt offering, were at that season
in the high place at gibeon.

21:30 but david could not go befor it to enquir of god: for he was
afraid becaus of the sword of the angel of the lord.

22:1 then david said, thi is the hous of the lord god, and thi is
th altar of the burnt offer for israel.

22:2 and david command to gather togeth the stranger that were in
th land of israel; and he set mason to hew wrought stone to build
th hous of god.

22:3 and david prepar iron in abund for the nail for the doors
of the gates, and for the joinings; and brass in abund without
weight; 22:4 also cedar tree in abundance: for the zidonian and they
of tyre brought much cedar wood to david.

22:5 and david said, solomon my son is young and tender, and the house
that is to be build for the lord must be exceed magnifical, of
fam and of glori throughout all countries: I will therefor now make
prepar for it. So david prepar abundantli befor hi death.

22:6 then he call for solomon hi son, and charg him to build an
hous for the lord god of israel.

22:7 and david said to solomon, My son, as for me, it wa in my mind
to build an hous unto the name of the lord my god: 22:8 but the word
of the lord came to me, saying, thou hast shed blood abundantly, and
hast made great wars: thou shalt not build an hous unto my name,
becaus thou hast shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.

22:9 behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest;
and I will give him rest from all hi enemi round about: for his
nam shall be solomon, and I will give peac and quiet unto israel
in hi days.

22:10 He shall build an hous for my name; and he shall be my son, and
i will be hi father; and I will establish the throne of hi kingdom
ov israel for ever.

22:11 now, my son, the lord be with thee; and prosper thou, and build
th hous of the lord thi god, as he hath said of thee.

22:12 onli the lord give thee wisdom and understanding, and give thee
charg concern israel, that thou mayest keep the law of the lord
thi god.

22:13 then shalt thou prosper, if thou takest heed to fulfil the
statut and judgment which the lord charg mose with concerning
israel: be strong, and of good courage; dread not, nor be dismayed.

22:14 now, behold, in my troubl I have prepar for the hous of the
lord an hundr thousand talent of gold, and a thousand thousand
tal of silver; and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in
abundance: timber also and stone have I prepared; and thou mayest add
thereto.

22:15 moreov there are workmen with thee in abundance, hewer and
work of stone and timber, and all manner of cun men for every
mann of work.

22:16 Of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is
no number. aris therefore, and be doing, and the lord be with thee.

22:17 david also command all the princ of israel to help solomon
hi son, saying, 22:18 Is not the lord your god with you? and hath he
not given you rest on everi side? for he hath given the inhabit of
th land into mine hand; and the land is subdu befor the lord, and
befor hi people.

22:19 now set your heart and your soul to seek the lord your god;
aris therefore, and build ye the sanctuari of the lord god, to bring
th ark of the coven of the lord, and the holi vessel of god, into
th hous that is to be built to the name of the lord.

23:1 So when david wa old and full of days, he made solomon hi son
k over israel.

23:2 and he gather togeth all the princ of israel, with the
priest and the levites.

23:3 now the levit were number from the age of thirti year and
upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, wa thirti and
eight thousand.

23:4 Of which, twenti and four thousand were to set forward the work
of the hous of the lord; and six thousand were offic and judges:
23:5 moreov four thousand were porters; and four thousand praised
th lord with the instrument which I made, said david, to praise
therewith.

23:6 and david divid them into cours among the son of levi,
namely, gershon, kohath, and merari.

23:7 Of the gershonit were, laadan, and shimei.

23:8 the son of laadan; the chief wa jehiel, and zetham, and joel,
three.

23:9 the son of shimei; shelomith, and haziel, and haran, three.
thes were the chief of the father of laadan.

23:10 and the son of shimei were, jahath, zina, and jeush, and
beriah.

thes four were the son of shimei.

23:11 and jahath wa the chief, and zizah the second: but jeush and
beriah had not mani sons; therefor they were in one reckoning,
accord to their father' house.

23:12 the son of kohath; amram, izhar, hebron, and uzziel, four.

23:13 the son of amram; aaron and moses: and aaron wa separated,
that he should sanctifi the most holi things, he and hi son for
ever, to burn incens befor the lord, to minist unto him, and to
bless in hi name for ever.

23:14 now concern mose the man of god, hi son were name of the
trib of levi.

23:15 the son of mose were, gershom, and eliezer.

23:16 Of the son of gershom, shebuel wa the chief.

23:17 and the son of eliez were, rehabiah the chief. and eliezer
had none other sons; but the son of rehabiah were veri many.

23:18 Of the son of izhar; shelomith the chief.

23:19 Of the son of hebron; jeriah the first, amariah the second,
jahaziel the third, and jekameam the fourth.

23:20 Of the son of uzziel; micah the first and jesiah the second.

23:21 the son of merari; mahli, and mushi. the son of mahli;
eleazar, and kish.

23:22 and eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters: and their
brethren the son of kish took them.

23:23 the son of mushi; mahli, and eder, and jeremoth, three.

23:24 these were the son of levi after the hous of their fathers;
even the chief of the fathers, as they were count by number of names
bi their polls, that did the work for the servic of the hous of the
lord, from the age of twenti year and upward.

23:25 for david said, the lord god of israel hath given rest unto his
people, that they may dwell in jerusalem for ever: 23:26 and also unto
th levites; they shall no more carri the tabernacle, nor ani vessels
of it for the servic thereof.

23:27 for by the last word of david the levit were number from
twenti year old and above: 23:28 becaus their offic wa to wait on
th son of aaron for the servic of the hous of the lord, in the
courts, and in the chambers, and in the purifi of all holi things,
and the work of the servic of the hous of god; 23:29 both for the
shewbread, and for the fine flour for meat offering, and for the
unleaven cakes, and for that which is bake in the pan, and for that
which is fried, and for all manner of measur and size; 23:30 and to
stand everi morn to thank and prais the lord, and likewis at
even: 23:31 and to offer all burnt sacrific unto the lord in the
sabbaths, in the new moons, and on the set feasts, by number,
accord to the order command unto them, continu befor the
lord: 23:32 and that they should keep the charg of the tabernacl of
th congregation, and the charg of the holi place, and the charg of
th son of aaron their brethren, in the servic of the hous of the
lord.

24:1 now these are the divis of the son of aaron. the son of
aaron; nadab, and abihu, eleazar, and ithamar.

24:2 but nadab and abihu die befor their father, and had no
children: therefor eleazar and ithamar execut the priest' office.

24:3 and david distribut them, both zadok of the son of eleazar,
and ahimelech of the son of ithamar, accord to their offic in
their service.

24:4 and there were more chief men found of the son of eleazar than
of the son of ithamar, and thu were they divided. among the son of
eleazar there were sixteen chief men of the hous of their fathers,
and eight among the son of ithamar accord to the hous of their
fathers.

24:5 thu were they divid by lot, one sort with another; for the
governor of the sanctuary, and governor of the hous of god, were of
th son of eleazar, and of the son of ithamar.

24:6 and shemaiah the son of nethaneel the scribe, one of the levites,
wrot them befor the king, and the princes, and zadok the priest, and
ahimelech the son of abiathar, and befor the chief of the father of
th priest and levites: one princip household be taken for
eleazar, and one taken for ithamar.

24:7 now the first lot came forth to jehoiarib, the second to jedaiah,
24:8 the third to harim, the fourth to seorim, 24:9 the fifth to
malchijah, the sixth to mijamin, 24:10 the seventh to hakkoz, the
eighth to abijah, 24:11 the ninth to jeshuah, the tenth to shecaniah,
24:12 the eleventh to eliashib, the twelfth to jakim, 24:13 the
thirteenth to huppah, the fourteenth to jeshebeab, 24:14 the fifteenth
to bilgah, the sixteenth to immer, 24:15 the seventeenth to hezir, the
eighteenth to aphses, 24:16 the nineteenth to pethahiah, the twentieth
to jehezekel, 24:17 the one and twentieth to jachin, the two and
twentieth to gamul, 24:18 the three and twentieth to delaiah, the four
and twentieth to maaziah.

24:19 these were the order of them in their servic to come into
th hous of the lord, accord to their manner, under aaron their
father, as the lord god of israel had command him.

24:20 and the rest of the son of levi were these: Of the son of
amram; shubael: of the son of shubael; jehdeiah.

24:21 concern rehabiah: of the son of rehabiah, the first was
isshiah.

24:22 Of the izharites; shelomoth: of the son of shelomoth; jahath.

24:23 and the son of hebron; jeriah the first, amariah the second,
jahaziel the third, jekameam the fourth.

24:24 Of the son of uzziel; michah: of the son of michah; shamir.

24:25 the brother of michah wa isshiah: of the son of isshiah;
zechariah.

24:26 the son of merari were mahli and mushi: the son of jaaziah;
beno.

24:27 the son of merari by jaaziah; beno, and shoham, and zaccur, and
ibri.

24:28 Of mahli came eleazar, who had no sons.

24:29 concern kish: the son of kish wa jerahmeel.

24:30 the son also of mushi; mahli, and eder, and jerimoth. these
wer the son of the levit after the hous of their fathers.

24:31 these likewis cast lot over against their brethren the son of
aaron in the presenc of david the king, and zadok, and ahimelech, and
th chief of the father of the priest and levites, even the
princip father over against their younger brethren.

25:1 moreov david and the captain of the host separ to the
servic of the son of asaph, and of heman, and of jeduthun, who
should prophesi with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the
numb of the workmen accord to their servic was: 25:2 Of the sons
of asaph; zaccur, and joseph, and nethaniah, and asarelah, the son of
asaph under the hand of asaph, which prophesi accord to the
ord of the king.

25:3 Of jeduthun: the son of jeduthun; gedaliah, and zeri, and
jeshaiah, hashabiah, and mattithiah, six, under the hand of their
fath jeduthun, who prophesi with a harp, to give thank and to
prais the lord.

25:4 Of heman: the son of heman: bukkiah, mattaniah, uzziel, shebuel,
and jerimoth, hananiah, hanani, eliathah, giddalti, and romamtiezer,
joshbekashah, mallothi, hothir, and mahazioth: 25:5 all these were the
son of heman the king' seer in the word of god, to lift up the
horn. and god gave to heman fourteen son and three daughters.

25:6 all these were under the hand of their father for song in the
hous of the lord, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, for the
servic of the hous of god, accord to the king' order to asaph,
jeduthun, and heman.

25:7 So the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed
in the song of the lord, even all that were cunning, wa two hundred
fourscor and eight.

25:8 and they cast lots, ward against ward, as well the small as the
great, the teacher as the scholar.

25:9 now the first lot came forth for asaph to joseph: the second to
gedaliah, who with hi brethren and son were twelve: 25:10 the third
to zaccur, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:11 the
fourth to izri, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:12 the
fifth to nethaniah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:13
the sixth to bukkiah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve:
25:14 the seventh to jesharelah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were
twelve: 25:15 the eighth to jeshaiah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren,
wer twelve: 25:16 the ninth to mattaniah, he, hi sons, and his
brethren, were twelve: 25:17 the tenth to shimei, he, hi sons, and
hi brethren, were twelve: 25:18 the eleventh to azareel, he, his
sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:19 the twelfth to hashabiah,
he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:20 the thirteenth to
shubael, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:21 the
fourteenth to mattithiah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve:
25:22 the fifteenth to jeremoth, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were
twelve: 25:23 the sixteenth to hananiah, he, hi sons, and his
brethren, were twelve: 25:24 the seventeenth to joshbekashah, he, his
sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:25 the eighteenth to hanani,
he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:26 the nineteenth to
mallothi, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:27 the
twentieth to eliathah, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve:
25:28 the one and twentieth to hothir, he, hi sons, and hi brethren,
wer twelve: 25:29 the two and twentieth to giddalti, he, hi sons,
and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:30 the three and twentieth to
mahazioth, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were twelve: 25:31 the four
and twentieth to romamtiezer, he, hi sons, and hi brethren, were
twelve.

26:1 concern the divis of the porters: Of the korhit was
meshelemiah the son of kore, of the son of asaph.

26:2 and the son of meshelemiah were, zechariah the firstborn,
jediael the second, zebadiah the third, jathniel the fourth, 26:3 elam
th fifth, jehohanan the sixth, elioenai the seventh.

26:4 moreov the son of obededom were, shemaiah the firstborn,
jehozabad the second, joah the third, and sacar the fourth, and
nethaneel the fifth.

26:5 ammiel the sixth, issachar the seventh, peulthai the eighth: for
god bless him.

26:6 also unto shemaiah hi son were son born, that rule throughout
th hous of their father: for they were mighti men of valour.

26:7 the son of shemaiah; othni, and rephael, and obed, elzabad,
whos brethren were strong men, elihu, and semachiah.

26:8 all these of the son of obededom: they and their son and their
brethren, abl men for strength for the service, were threescor and
two of obededom.

26:9 and meshelemiah had son and brethren, strong men, eighteen.

26:10 also hosah, of the children of merari, had sons; simri the
chief, (for though he wa not the firstborn, yet hi father made him
th chief;) 26:11 hilkiah the second, tebaliah the third, zechariah
th fourth: all the son and brethren of hosah were thirteen.

26:12 among these were the divis of the porters, even among the
chief men, have ward one against another, to minist in the house
of the lord.

26:13 and they cast lots, as well the small as the great, accord to
th hous of their fathers, for everi gate.

26:14 and the lot eastward fell to shelemiah. then for zechariah his
son, a wise counsellor, they cast lots; and hi lot came out
northward.

26:15 To obededom southward; and to hi son the hous of asuppim.

26:16 To shuppim and hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate
shallecheth, by the causeway of the go up, ward against ward.

26:17 eastward were six levites, northward four a day, southward four
a day, and toward asuppim two and two.

26:18 At parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at parbar.

26:19 these are the divis of the porter among the son of kore,
and among the son of merari.

26:20 and of the levites, ahijah wa over the treasur of the house
of god, and over the treasur of the dedic things.

26:21 As concern the son of laadan; the son of the gershonite
laadan, chief fathers, even of laadan the gershonite, were jehieli.

26:22 the son of jehieli; zetham, and joel hi brother, which were
ov the treasur of the hous of the lord.

26:23 Of the amramites, and the izharites, the hebronites, and the
uzzielites: 26:24 and shebuel the son of gershom, the son of moses,
wa ruler of the treasures.

26:25 and hi brethren by eliezer; rehabiah hi son, and jeshaiah his
son, and joram hi son, and zichri hi son, and shelomith hi son.

26:26 which shelomith and hi brethren were over all the treasur of
th dedic things, which david the king, and the chief fathers, the
captain over thousand and hundreds, and the captain of the host,
had dedicated.

26:27 out of the spoil won in battl did they dedic to maintain
th hous of the lord.

26:28 and all that samuel the seer, and saul the son of kish, and
abn the son of ner, and joab the son of zeruiah, had dedicated; and
whosoev had dedic ani thing, it wa under the hand of shelomith,
and of hi brethren.

26:29 Of the izharites, chenaniah and hi son were for the outward
busi over israel, for offic and judges.

26:30 and of the hebronites, hashabiah and hi brethren, men of
valour, a thousand and seven hundred, were offic among them of
israel on thi side jordan westward in all the busi of the lord,
and in the servic of the king.

26:31 among the hebronit wa jerijah the chief, even among the
hebronites, accord to the gener of hi fathers. In the
fortieth year of the reign of david they were sought for, and there
wer found among them mighti men of valour at jazer of gilead.

26:32 and hi brethren, men of valour, were two thousand and seven
hundr chief fathers, whom king david made ruler over the
reubenites, the gadites, and the half tribe of manasseh, for every
matt pertain to god, and affair of the king.

27:1 now the children of israel after their number, to wit, the chief
fath and captain of thousand and hundreds, and their officers
that serv the king in ani matter of the courses, which came in and
went out month by month throughout all the month of the year, of
everi cours were twenti and four thousand.

27:2 over the first cours for the first month wa jashobeam the son
of zabdiel: and in hi cours were twenti and four thousand.

27:3 Of the children of perez wa the chief of all the captain of the
host for the first month.

27:4 and over the cours of the second month wa dodai an ahohite, and
of hi cours wa mikloth also the ruler: in hi cours likewis were
twenti and four thousand.

27:5 the third captain of the host for the third month wa benaiah the
son of jehoiada, a chief priest: and in hi cours were twenti and
four thousand.

27:6 thi is that benaiah, who wa mighti among the thirty, and above
th thirty: and in hi cours wa ammizabad hi son.

27:7 the fourth captain for the fourth month wa asahel the brother of
joab, and zebadiah hi son after him: and in hi cours were twenty
and four thousand.

27:8 the fifth captain for the fifth month wa shamhuth the izrahite:
and in hi cours were twenti and four thousand.

27:9 the sixth captain for the sixth month wa ira the son of ikkesh
th tekoite: and in hi cours were twenti and four thousand.

27:10 the seventh captain for the seventh month wa helez the
pelonite, of the children of ephraim: and in hi cours were twenty
and four thousand.

27:11 the eighth captain for the eighth month wa sibbecai the
hushathite, of the zarhites: and in hi cours were twenti and four
thousand.

27:12 the ninth captain for the ninth month wa abiez the
anetothite, of the benjamites: and in hi cours were twenti and four
thousand.

27:13 the tenth captain for the tenth month wa maharai the
netophathite, of the zarhites: and in hi cours were twenti and four
thousand.

27:14 the eleventh captain for the eleventh month wa benaiah the
pirathonite, of the children of ephraim: and in hi cours were twenty
and four thousand.

27:15 the twelfth captain for the twelfth month wa heldai the
netophathite, of othniel: and in hi cours were twenti and four
thousand.

27:16 furthermor over the tribe of israel: the ruler of the
reubenit wa eliez the son of zichri: of the simeonites,
shephatiah the son of maachah: 27:17 Of the levites, hashabiah the son
of kemuel: of the aaronites, zadok: 27:18 Of judah, elihu, one of the
brethren of david: of issachar, omri the son of michael: 27:19 of
zebulun, ishmaiah the son of obadiah: of naphtali, jerimoth the son of
azriel: 27:20 Of the children of ephraim, hoshea the son of azaziah:
of the half tribe of manasseh, joel the son of pedaiah: 27:21 Of the
half tribe of manasseh in gilead, iddo the son of zechariah: of
benjamin, jaasiel the son of abner: 27:22 Of dan, azareel the son of
jeroham. these were the princ of the tribe of israel.

27:23 but david took not the number of them from twenti year old and
under: becaus the lord had said he would increas israel like to the
star of the heavens.

27:24 joab the son of zeruiah began to number, but he finish not,
becaus there fell wrath for it against israel; neither wa the number
put in the account of the chronicl of king david.

27:25 and over the king' treasur wa azmaveth the son of adiel: and
ov the storehous in the fields, in the cities, and in the
villages, and in the castles, wa jehonathan the son of uzziah: 27:26
and over them that did the work of the field for tillag of the ground
wa ezri the son of chelub: 27:27 and over the vineyard wa shimei
th ramathite: over the increas of the vineyard for the wine cellars
wa zabdi the shiphmite: 27:28 and over the oliv tree and the
sycomor tree that were in the low plain wa baalhanan the gederite:
and over the cellar of oil wa joash: 27:29 and over the herd that
f in sharon wa shitrai the sharonite: and over the herd that were
in the valley wa shaphat the son of adlai: 27:30 over the camels
also wa obil the ishmaelite: and over the ass wa jehdeiah the
meronothite: 27:31 and over the flock wa jaziz the hagerite. all
thes were the ruler of the substanc which wa king david's.

27:32 also jonathan david' uncl wa a counsellor, a wise man, and a
scribe: and jehiel the son of hachmoni wa with the king' sons: 27:33
and ahithophel wa the king' counsellor: and hushai the archit was
th king' companion: 27:34 and after ahithophel wa jehoiada the son
of benaiah, and abiathar: and the gener of the king' armi wa joab.

28:1 and david assembl all the princ of israel, the princ of the
tribes, and the captain of the compani that minist to the king
bi course, and the captain over the thousands, and captain over the
hundreds, and the steward over all the substanc and possess of
th king, and of hi sons, with the officers, and with the mighti men,
and with all the valiant men, unto jerusalem.

28:2 then david the king stood up upon hi feet, and said, hear me, my
brethren, and my people: As for me, I had in mine heart to build an
hous of rest for the ark of the coven of the lord, and for the
footstool of our god, and had made readi for the building: 28:3 but
god said unto me, thou shalt not build an hous for my name, because
th hast been a man of war, and hast shed blood.

28:4 howbeit the lord god of israel chose me befor all the hous of
mi father to be king over israel for ever: for he hath chosen judah to
b the ruler; and of the hous of judah, the hous of my father; and
among the son of my father he like me to make me king over all
israel: 28:5 and of all my sons, (for the lord hath given me many
sons,) he hath chosen solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the
kingdom of the lord over israel.

28:6 and he said unto me, solomon thi son, he shall build my hous and
mi courts: for I have chosen him to be my son, and I will be his
father.

28:7 moreov I will establish hi kingdom for ever, if he be constant
to do my command and my judgments, as at thi day.

28:8 now therefor in the sight of all israel the congreg of the
lord, and in the audienc of our god, keep and seek for all the
command of the lord your god: that ye may possess thi good land,
and leav it for an inherit for your children after you for ever.

28:9 and thou, solomon my son, know thou the god of thi father, and
serv him with a perfect heart and with a will mind: for the lord
searcheth all hearts, and understandeth all the imagin of the
thoughts: if thou seek him, he will be found of thee; but if thou
forsak him, he will cast thee off for ever.

28:10 take heed now; for the lord hath chosen thee to build an house
for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.

28:11 then david gave to solomon hi son the pattern of the porch, and
of the hous thereof, and of the treasuri thereof, and of the upper
chamb thereof, and of the inner parlour thereof, and of the place
of the merci seat, 28:12 and the pattern of all that he had by the
spirit, of the court of the hous of the lord, and of all the
chamb round about, of the treasuri of the hous of god, and of
th treasuri of the dedic things: 28:13 also for the cours of
th priest and the levites, and for all the work of the servic of
th hous of the lord, and for all the vessel of servic in the house
of the lord.

28:14 He gave of gold by weight for thing of gold, for all
instru of all manner of service; silver also for all instruments
of silver by weight, for all instrument of everi kind of service:
28:15 even the weight for the candlestick of gold, and for their
lamp of gold, by weight for everi candlestick, and for the lamps
thereof: and for the candlestick of silver by weight, both for the
candlestick, and also for the lamp thereof, accord to the use of
everi candlestick.

28:16 and by weight he gave gold for the tabl of shewbread, for
everi table; and likewis silver for the tabl of silver: 28:17 also
pur gold for the fleshhooks, and the bowls, and the cups: and for the
golden bason he gave gold by weight for everi bason; and likewise
silv by weight for everi bason of silver: 28:18 and for the altar of
incens refin gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the
chariot of the cherubims, that spread out their wings, and cover the
ark of the coven of the lord.

28:19 all this, said david, the lord made me understand in write by
hi hand upon me, even all the work of thi pattern.

28:20 and david said to solomon hi son, Be strong and of good
courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed: for the lord god, even
mi god, will be with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsak thee,
until thou hast finish all the work for the servic of the hous of
th lord.

28:21 and, behold, the cours of the priest and the levites, even
they shall be with thee for all the servic of the hous of god: and
ther shall be with thee for all manner of workmanship everi willing
skil man, for ani manner of service: also the princ and all the
peopl will be wholli at thi commandment.

29:1 furthermor david the king said unto all the congregation,
solomon my son, whom alon god hath chosen, is yet young and tender,
and the work is great: for the palac is not for man, but for the lord
god.

29:2 now I have prepar with all my might for the hous of my god the
gold for thing to be made of gold, and the silver for thing of
silver, and the brass for thing of brass, the iron for thing of
iron, and wood for thing of wood; onyx stones, and stone to be set,
glist stones, and of diver colours, and all manner of precious
stones, and marbl stone in abundance.

29:3 moreover, becaus I have set my affect to the hous of my god,
i have of mine own proper good, of gold and silver, which I have given
to the hous of my god, over and abov all that I have prepar for
th holi house.

29:4 even three thousand talent of gold, of the gold of ophir, and
seven thousand talent of refin silver, to overlay the wall of the
hous withal: 29:5 the gold for thing of gold, and the silver for
th of silver, and for all manner of work to be made by the hands
of artificers. and who then is will to consecr hi servic this
day unto the lord?  29:6 then the chief of the father and princ of
th tribe of israel and the captain of thousand and of hundreds,
with the ruler of the king' work, offer willingly, 29:7 and gave
for the servic of the hous of god of gold five thousand talent and
ten thousand drams, and of silver ten thousand talents, and of brass
eighteen thousand talents, and one hundr thousand talent of iron.

29:8 and they with whom preciou stone were found gave them to the
treasur of the hous of the lord, by the hand of jehiel the
gershonite.

29:9 then the peopl rejoiced, for that they offer willingly,
becaus with perfect heart they offer willingli to the lord: and
david the king also rejoic with great joy.

29:10 wherefor david bless the lord befor all the congregation:
and david said, bless be thou, lord god of israel our father, for
ev and ever.

29:11 thine, O lord is the greatness, and the power, and the glory,
and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is in the heaven and in
th earth is thine; thine is the kingdom, O lord, and thou art exalted
a head abov all.

29:12 both rich and honour come of thee, and thou reignest over all;
and in thine hand is power and might; and in thine hand it is to make
great, and to give strength unto all.

29:13 now therefore, our god, we thank thee, and prais thi glorious
name.

29:14 but who am I, and what is my people, that we should be abl to
off so willingli after thi sort? for all thing come of thee, and
of thine own have we given thee.

29:15 for we are stranger befor thee, and sojourners, as were all
our fathers: our day on the earth are as a shadow, and there is none
abiding.

29:16 O lord our god, all thi store that we have prepar to build
the an hous for thine holi name cometh of thine hand, and is all
thin own.

29:17 I know also, my god, that thou triest the heart, and hast
pleasur in uprightness. As for me, in the upright of mine heart i
hav willingli offer all these things: and now have I seen with joy
thi people, which are present here, to offer willingli unto thee.

29:18 O lord god of abraham, isaac, and of israel, our fathers, keep
thi for ever in the imagin of the thought of the heart of thy
people, and prepar their heart unto thee: 29:19 and give unto solomon
mi son a perfect heart, to keep thi commandments, thi testimonies, and
thi statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for
th which I have made provision.

29:20 and david said to all the congregation, now bless the lord your
god.

and all the congreg bless the lord god of their fathers, and
bow down their heads, and worship the lord, and the king.

29:21 and they sacrif sacrific unto the lord, and offer burnt
off unto the lord, on the morrow after that day, even a thousand
bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink
offerings, and sacrific in abund for all israel: 29:22 and did
eat and drink befor the lord on that day with great gladness. and
they made solomon the son of david king the second time, and anointed
him unto the lord to be the chief governor, and zadok to be priest.

29:23 then solomon sat on the throne of the lord as king instead of
david hi father, and prospered; and all israel obey him.

29:24 and all the princes, and the mighti men, and all the sons
likewis of king david, submit themselv unto solomon the king.

29:25 and the lord magnifi solomon exceedingli in the sight of all
israel, and bestow upon him such royal majesti as had not been on
ani king befor him in israel.

29:26 thu david the son of jess reign over all israel.

29:27 and the time that he reign over israel wa forti years; seven
year reign he in hebron, and thirti and three year reign he in
jerusalem.

29:28 and he die in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honour:
and solomon hi son reign in hi stead.

29:29 now the act of david the king, first and last, behold, they are
written in the book of samuel the seer, and in the book of nathan the
prophet, and in the book of gad the seer, 29:30 with all hi reign and
hi might, and the time that went over him, and over israel, and over
al the kingdom of the countries.




th second book of the chronicles


1:1 and solomon the son of david wa strengthen in hi kingdom, and
th lord hi god wa with him, and magnifi him exceedingly.

1:2 then solomon spake unto all israel, to the captain of thousands
and of hundreds, and to the judges, and to everi governor in all
israel, the chief of the fathers.

1:3 So solomon, and all the congreg with him, went to the high
plac that wa at gibeon; for there wa the tabernacl of the
congreg of god, which mose the servant of the lord had made in
th wilderness.

1:4 but the ark of god had david brought up from kirjathjearim to the
plac which david had prepar for it: for he had pitch a tent for
it at jerusalem.

1:5 moreov the brasen altar, that bezaleel the son of uri, the son
of hur, had made, he put befor the tabernacl of the lord: and
solomon and the congreg sought unto it.

1:6 and solomon went up thither to the brasen altar befor the lord,
which wa at the tabernacl of the congregation, and offer a
thousand burnt offer upon it.

1:7 In that night did god appear unto solomon, and said unto him, ask
what I shall give thee.

1:8 and solomon said unto god, thou hast shew great merci unto david
mi father, and hast made me to reign in hi stead.

1:9 now, O lord god, let thi promis unto david my father be
established: for thou hast made me king over a peopl like the dust of
th earth in multitude.

1:10 give me now wisdom and knowledge, that I may go out and come in
befor thi people: for who can judg thi thi people, that is so
great?  1:11 and god said to solomon, becaus thi wa in thine heart,
and thou hast not ask riches, wealth, or honour, nor the life of
thin enemies, neither yet hast ask long life; but hast ask wisdom
and knowledg for thyself, that thou mayest judg my people, over whom
i have made thee king: 1:12 wisdom and knowledg is grant unto thee;
and I will give thee riches, and wealth, and honour, such as none of
th king have had that have been befor thee, neither shall there any
aft thee have the like.

1:13 then solomon came from hi journey to the high place that wa at
gibeon to jerusalem, from befor the tabernacl of the congregation,
and reign over israel.

1:14 and solomon gather chariot and horsemen: and he had a thousand
and four hundr chariots, and twelv thousand horsemen, which he
plac in the chariot cities, and with the king at jerusalem.

1:15 and the king made silver and gold at jerusalem as plenteou as
stones, and cedar tree made he as the sycomor tree that are in the
val for abundance.

1:16 and solomon had hors brought out of egypt, and linen yarn: the
king' merchant receiv the linen yarn at a price.

1:17 and they fetch up, and brought forth out of egypt a chariot for
six hundr shekel of silver, and an hors for an hundr and fifty:
and so brought they out hors for all the king of the hittites, and
for the king of syria, by their means.

2:1 and solomon determin to build an hous for the name of the lord,
and an hous for hi kingdom.

2:2 and solomon told out threescor and ten thousand men to bear
burdens, and fourscor thousand to hew in the mountain, and three
thousand and six hundr to overse them.

2:3 and solomon sent to huram the king of tyre, saying, As thou didst
deal with david my father, and didst send him cedar to build him an
hous to dwell therein, even so deal with me.

2:4 behold, I build an hous to the name of the lord my god, to
ded it to him, and to burn befor him sweet incense, and for the
continu shewbread, and for the burnt offer morn and evening,
on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn feast of the
lord our god. thi is an ordin for ever to israel.

2:5 and the hous which I build is great: for great is our god above
al gods.

2:6 but who is abl to build him an house, see the heaven and
heaven of heaven cannot contain him? who am I then, that I should
build him an house, save onli to burn sacrific befor him?  2:7 send
m now therefor a man cun to work in gold, and in silver, and in
brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and that can
skil to grave with the cun men that are with me in judah and in
jerusalem, whom david my father did provide.

2:8 send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of
lebanon: for I know that thi servant can skill to cut timber in
lebanon; and, behold, my servant shall be with thi servants, 2:9 even
to prepar me timber in abundance: for the hous which I am about to
build shall be wonder great.

2:10 and, behold, I will give to thi servants, the hewer that cut
timber, twenti thousand measur of beaten wheat, and twenti thousand
measur of barley, and twenti thousand bath of wine, and twenty
thousand bath of oil.

2:11 then huram the king of tyre answer in writing, which he sent to
solomon, becaus the lord hath love hi people, he hath made thee
k over them.

2:12 huram said moreover, bless be the lord god of israel, that made
heaven and earth, who hath given to david the king a wise son, endued
with prudenc and understanding, that might build an hous for the
lord, and an hous for hi kingdom.

2:13 and now I have sent a cun man, endu with understanding, of
huram my father's, 2:14 the son of a woman of the daughter of dan,
and hi father wa a man of tyre, skil to work in gold, and in
silver, in brass, in iron, in stone, and in timber, in purple, in
blue, and in fine linen, and in crimson; also to grave ani manner of
graving, and to find out everi devic which shall be put to him, with
thi cun men, and with the cun men of my lord david thi father.

2:15 now therefor the wheat, and the barley, the oil, and the wine,
which my lord hath spoken of, let him send unto hi servants: 2:16 and
w will cut wood out of lebanon, as much as thou shalt need: and we
wil bring it to thee in float by sea to joppa; and thou shalt carry
it up to jerusalem.

2:17 and solomon number all the stranger that were in the land of
israel, after the number wherewith david hi father had numbered
them; and they were found an hundr and fifti thousand and three
thousand and six hundred.

2:18 and he set threescor and ten thousand of them to be bearer of
burdens, and fourscor thousand to be hewer in the mountain, and
thre thousand and six hundr overs to set the peopl a work.

3:1 then solomon began to build the hous of the lord at jerusalem in
mount moriah, where the lord appear unto david hi father, in the
plac that david had prepar in the threshingfloor of ornan the
jebusite.

3:2 and he began to build in the second day of the second month, in
th fourth year of hi reign.

3:3 now these are the thing wherein solomon wa instruct for the
build of the hous of god. the length by cubit after the first
measur wa threescor cubits, and the breadth twenti cubits.

3:4 and the porch that wa in the front of the house, the length of it
wa accord to the breadth of the house, twenti cubits, and the
height wa an hundr and twenty: and he overlaid it within with pure
gold.

3:5 and the greater hous he ciel with fir tree, which he overlaid
with fine gold, and set thereon palm tree and chains.

3:6 and he garnish the hous with preciou stone for beauty: and
th gold wa gold of parvaim.

3:7 He overlaid also the house, the beams, the posts, and the walls
thereof, and the door thereof, with gold; and grave cherubim on the
walls.

3:8 and he made the most holi house, the length whereof wa according
to the breadth of the house, twenti cubits, and the breadth thereof
twenti cubits: and he overlaid it with fine gold, amount to six
hundr talents.

3:9 and the weight of the nail wa fifti shekel of gold. and he
overlaid the upper chamber with gold.

3:10 and in the most holi hous he made two cherubim of imag work,
and overlaid them with gold.

3:11 and the wing of the cherubim were twenti cubit long: one wing
of the one cherub wa five cubits, reach to the wall of the house:
and the other wing wa likewis five cubits, reach to the wing of
th other cherub.

3:12 and one wing of the other cherub wa five cubits, reach to the
wal of the house: and the other wing wa five cubit also, join to
th wing of the other cherub.

3:13 the wing of these cherubim spread themselv forth twenty
cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their face were inward.

3:14 and he made the vail of blue, and purple, and crimson, and fine
linen, and wrought cherubim thereon.

3:15 also he made befor the hous two pillar of thirti and five
cubit high, and the chapit that wa on the top of each of them was
fiv cubits.

3:16 and he made chains, as in the oracle, and put them on the heads
of the pillars; and made an hundr pomegranates, and put them on the
chains.

3:17 and he rear up the pillar befor the temple, one on the right
hand, and the other on the left; and call the name of that on the
right hand jachin, and the name of that on the left boaz.

4:1 moreov he made an altar of brass, twenti cubit the length
thereof, and twenti cubit the breadth thereof, and ten cubit the
height thereof.

4:2 also he made a molten sea of ten cubit from brim to brim, round
in compass, and five cubit the height thereof; and a line of thirty
cubit did compass it round about.

4:3 and under it wa the similitud of oxen, which did compass it
round about: ten in a cubit, compass the sea round about. two rows
of oxen were cast, when it wa cast.

4:4 It stood upon twelv oxen, three look toward the north, and
thre look toward the west, and three look toward the south, and
thre look toward the east: and the sea wa set abov upon them,
and all their hinder part were inward.

4:5 and the thick of it wa an handbreadth, and the brim of it
lik the work of the brim of a cup, with flower of lilies; and it
receiv and held three thousand baths.

4:6 He made also ten lavers, and put five on the right hand, and five
on the left, to wash in them: such thing as they offer for the
burnt offer they wash in them; but the sea wa for the priest to
wash in.

4:7 and he made ten candlestick of gold accord to their form, and
set them in the temple, five on the right hand, and five on the left.

4:8 He made also ten tables, and place them in the temple, five on
th right side, and five on the left. and he made an hundr bason of
gold.

4:9 furthermor he made the court of the priests, and the great court,
and door for the court, and overlaid the door of them with brass.

4:10 and he set the sea on the right side of the east end, over
against the south.

4:11 and huram made the pots, and the shovels, and the basons. and
huram finish the work that he wa to make for king solomon for the
hous of god; 4:12 To wit, the two pillars, and the pommels, and the
chapit which were on the top of the two pillars, and the two
wreath to cover the two pommel of the chapit which were on the
top of the pillars; 4:13 and four hundr pomegran on the two
wreaths; two row of pomegran on each wreath, to cover the two
pommel of the chapit which were upon the pillars.

4:14 He made also bases, and laver made he upon the bases; 4:15 one
sea, and twelv oxen under it.

4:16 the pot also, and the shovels, and the fleshhooks, and all their
instruments, did huram hi father make to king solomon for the house
of the lord of bright brass.

4:17 In the plain of jordan did the king cast them, in the clay ground
between succoth and zeredathah.

4:18 thu solomon made all these vessel in great abundance: for the
weight of the brass could not be found out.

4:19 and solomon made all the vessel that were for the hous of god,
th golden altar also, and the tabl whereon the shewbread wa set;
4:20 moreov the candlestick with their lamps, that they should burn
aft the manner befor the oracle, of pure gold; 4:21 and the
flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, made he of gold, and that
perfect gold; 4:22 and the snuffers, and the basons, and the spoons,
and the censers, of pure gold: and the entri of the house, the inner
door thereof for the most holi place, and the door of the hous of
th temple, were of gold.

5:1 thu all the work that solomon made for the hous of the lord was
finished: and solomon brought in all the thing that david hi father
had dedicated; and the silver, and the gold, and all the instruments,
put he among the treasur of the hous of god.

5:2 then solomon assembl the elder of israel, and all the head of
th tribes, the chief of the father of the children of israel, unto
jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the coven of the lord out of the
citi of david, which is zion.

5:3 wherefor all the men of israel assembl themselv unto the king
in the feast which wa in the seventh month.

5:4 and all the elder of israel came; and the levit took up the
ark.

5:5 and they brought up the ark, and the tabernacl of the
congregation, and all the holi vessel that were in the tabernacle,
thes did the priest and the levit bring up.

5:6 also king solomon, and all the congreg of israel that were
assembl unto him befor the ark, sacrif sheep and oxen, which
could not be told nor number for multitude.

5:7 and the priest brought in the ark of the coven of the lord
unto hi place, to the oracl of the house, into the most holi place,
even under the wing of the cherubims: 5:8 for the cherubim spread
forth their wing over the place of the ark, and the cherubim covered
th ark and the stave thereof above.

5:9 and they drew out the stave of the ark, that the end of the
stav were seen from the ark befor the oracle; but they were not
seen without. and there it is unto thi day.

5:10 there wa noth in the ark save the two tabl which mose put
therein at horeb, when the lord made a coven with the children of
israel, when they came out of egypt.

5:11 and it came to pass, when the priest were come out of the holy
place: (for all the priest that were present were sanctified, and did
not then wait by course: 5:12 also the levit which were the singers,
al of them of asaph, of heman, of jeduthun, with their son and their
brethren, be array in white linen, have cymbal and psalteries
and harps, stood at the east end of the altar, and with them an
hundr and twenti priest sound with trumpets:) 5:13 It came even
to pass, as the trumpet and singer were as one, to make one sound
to be heard in prais and thank the lord; and when they lift up
their voic with the trumpet and cymbal and instrument of musick,
and prais the lord, saying, for he is good; for hi merci endureth
for ever: that then the hous wa fill with a cloud, even the house
of the lord; 5:14 So that the priest could not stand to minist by
reason of the cloud: for the glori of the lord had fill the hous of
god.

6:1 then said solomon, the lord hath said that he would dwell in the
thick darkness.

6:2 but I have built an hous of habit for thee, and a place for
thi dwell for ever.

6:3 and the king turn hi face, and bless the whole congregation
of israel: and all the congreg of israel stood.

6:4 and he said, bless be the lord god of israel, who hath with his
hand fulfil that which he spake with hi mouth to my father david,
saying, 6:5 sinc the day that I brought forth my peopl out of the
land of egypt I chose no citi among all the tribe of israel to build
an hous in, that my name might be there; neither chose I ani man to
b a ruler over my peopl israel: 6:6 but I have chosen jerusalem,
that my name might be there; and have chosen david to be over my
peopl israel.

6:7 now it wa in the heart of david my father to build an hous for
th name of the lord god of israel.

6:8 but the lord said to david my father, forasmuch as it wa in thine
heart to build an hous for my name, thou didst well in that it wa in
thin heart: 6:9 notwithstand thou shalt not build the house; but
thi son which shall come forth out of thi loins, he shall build the
hous for my name.

6:10 the lord therefor hath perform hi word that he hath spoken:
for I am risen up in the room of david my father, and am set on the
thron of israel, as the lord promised, and have built the hous for
th name of the lord god of israel.

6:11 and in it have I put the ark, wherein is the coven of the
lord, that he made with the children of israel.

6:12 and he stood befor the altar of the lord in the presenc of all
th congreg of israel, and spread forth hi hands: 6:13 for
solomon had made a brasen scaffold of five cubit long, and five
cubit broad, and three cubit high, and had set it in the midst of
th court: and upon it he stood, and kneel down upon hi knees
befor all the congreg of israel, and spread forth hi hands
toward heaven.

6:14 and said, O lord god of israel, there is no god like thee in the
heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy
unto thi servants, that walk befor thee with all their hearts: 6:15
thou which hast kept with thi servant david my father that which thou
hast promis him; and spakest with thi mouth, and hast fulfil it
with thine hand, as it is thi day.

6:16 now therefore, O lord god of israel, keep with thi servant david
mi father that which thou hast promis him, saying, there shall not
fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of israel; yet so
that thi children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou
hast walk befor me.

6:17 now then, O lord god of israel, let thi word be verified, which
thou hast spoken unto thi servant david.

6:18 but will god in veri deed dwell with men on the earth? behold,
heaven and the heaven of heaven cannot contain thee; how much less
thi hous which I have built!  6:19 have respect therefor to the
pray of thi servant, and to hi supplication, O lord my god, to
hearken unto the cri and the prayer which thi servant prayeth before
thee: 6:20 that thine eye may be open upon thi hous day and night,
upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thi name
there; to hearken unto the prayer which thi servant prayeth toward
thi place.

6:21 hearken therefor unto the supplic of thi servant, and of
thi peopl israel, which they shall make toward thi place: hear thou
from thi dwell place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest,
forgive.

6:22 If a man sin against hi neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him
to make him swear, and the oath come befor thine altar in thi house;
6:23 then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judg thi servants, by
requit the wicked, by recompens hi way upon hi own head; and
bi justifi the righteous, by give him accord to his
righteousness.

6:24 and if thi peopl israel be put to the wors befor the enemy,
becaus they have sin against thee; and shall return and confess
thi name, and pray and make supplic befor thee in thi house;
6:25 then hear thou from the heavens, and forgiv the sin of thy
peopl israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to
them and to their fathers.

6:26 when the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, becaus they
hav sin against thee; yet if they pray toward thi place, and
confess thi name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict
them; 6:27 then hear thou from heaven, and forgiv the sin of thy
servants, and of thi peopl israel, when thou hast taught them the
good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thi land, which
thou hast given unto thi peopl for an inheritance.

6:28 If there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there
b blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies
besieg them in the citi of their land; whatsoev sore or
whatsoev sick there be: 6:29 then what prayer or what
suppl soever shall be made of ani man, or of all thi people
israel, when everi one shall know hi own sore and hi own grief, and
shal spread forth hi hand in thi house: 6:30 then hear thou from
heaven thi dwell place, and forgive, and render unto everi man
accord unto all hi ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only
knowest the heart of the children of men:) 6:31 that they may fear
thee, to walk in thi ways, so long as they live in the land which thou
gavest unto our fathers.

6:32 moreov concern the stranger, which is not of thi people
israel, but is come from a far countri for thi great name' sake, and
thi mighti hand, and thi stretch out arm; if they come and pray in
thi house; 6:33 then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy
dwel place, and do accord to all that the stranger calleth to
the for; that all peopl of the earth may know thi name, and fear
thee, as doth thi peopl israel, and may know that thi hous which i
hav built is call by thi name.

6:34 If thi peopl go out to war against their enemi by the way that
thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward thi citi which
thou hast chosen, and the hous which I have built for thi name; 6:35
then hear thou from the heaven their prayer and their supplication,
and maintain their cause.

6:36 If they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth
not,) and thou be angri with them, and deliv them over befor their
enemies, and they carri them away captiv unto a land far off or
near; 6:37 yet if they bethink themselv in the land whither they are
carri captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their
captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt
wickedly; 6:38 If they return to thee with all their heart and with
al their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have
carri them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest
unto their fathers, and toward the citi which thou hast chosen, and
toward the hous which I have built for thi name: 6:39 then hear thou
from the heavens, even from thi dwell place, their prayer and their
supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgiv thi peopl which
hav sin against thee.

6:40 now, my god, let, I beseech thee, thine eye be open, and let
thin ear be attent unto the prayer that is made in thi place.

6:41 now therefor arise, O lord god, into thi rest place, thou,
and the ark of thi strength: let thi priests, O lord god, be clothed
with salvation, and let thi saint rejoic in goodness.

6:42 O lord god, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember
th merci of david thi servant.

7:1 now when solomon had made an end of praying, the fire came down
from heaven, and consum the burnt offer and the sacrifices; and
th glori of the lord fill the house.

7:2 and the priest could not enter into the hous of the lord,
becaus the glori of the lord had fill the lord' house.

7:3 and when all the children of israel saw how the fire came down,
and the glori of the lord upon the house, they bow themselv with
their face to the ground upon the pavement, and worshipped, and
prais the lord, saying, for he is good; for hi merci endureth for
ever.

7:4 then the king and all the peopl offer sacrific befor the
lord.

7:5 and king solomon offer a sacrific of twenti and two thousand
oxen, and an hundr and twenti thousand sheep: so the king and all
th peopl dedic the hous of god.

7:6 and the priest wait on their offices: the levit also with
instru of musick of the lord, which david the king had made to
prais the lord, becaus hi merci endureth for ever, when david
prais by their ministry; and the priest sound trumpet before
them, and all israel stood.

7:7 moreov solomon hallow the middl of the court that wa before
th hous of the lord: for there he offer burnt offerings, and the
fat of the peac offerings, becaus the brasen altar which solomon had
mad wa not abl to receiv the burnt offerings, and the meat
offerings, and the fat.

7:8 also at the same time solomon kept the feast seven days, and all
israel with him, a veri great congregation, from the enter in of
hamath unto the river of egypt.

7:9 and in the eighth day they made a solemn assembly: for they kept
th dedic of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.

7:10 and on the three and twentieth day of the seventh month he sent
th peopl away into their tents, glad and merri in heart for the
good that the lord had shew unto david, and to solomon, and to
israel hi people.

7:11 thu solomon finish the hous of the lord, and the king's
house: and all that came into solomon' heart to make in the hous of
th lord, and in hi own house, he prosper effected.

7:12 and the lord appear to solomon by night, and said unto him, i
hav heard thi prayer, and have chosen thi place to myself for an
hous of sacrifice.

7:13 If I shut up heaven that there be no rain, or if I command the
locust to devour the land, or if I send pestil among my people;
7:14 If my people, which are call by my name, shall humble
themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked
ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgiv their sin, and
wil heal their land.

7:15 now mine eye shall be open, and mine ear attent unto the prayer
that is made in thi place.

7:16 for now have I chosen and sanctifi thi house, that my name may
b there for ever: and mine eye and mine heart shall be there
perpetually.

7:17 and as for thee, if thou wilt walk befor me, as david thi father
walked, and do accord to all that I have command thee, and shalt
observ my statut and my judgments; 7:18 then will I stablish the
thron of thi kingdom, accord as I have coven with david thy
father, saying, there shall not fail thee a man to be ruler in israel.

7:19 but if ye turn away, and forsak my statut and my commandments,
which I have set befor you, and shall go and serv other gods, and
worship them; 7:20 then will I pluck them up by the root out of my
land which I have given them; and thi house, which I have sanctified
for my name, will I cast out of my sight, and will make it to be a
proverb and a byword among all nations.

7:21 and thi house, which is high, shall be an astonish to every
on that passeth by it; so that he shall say, whi hath the lord done
thu unto thi land, and unto thi house?  7:22 and it shall be
answered, becaus they forsook the lord god of their fathers, which
brought them forth out of the land of egypt, and laid hold on other
gods, and worship them, and serv them: therefor hath he brought
al thi evil upon them.

8:1 and it came to pass at the end of twenti years, wherein solomon
had built the hous of the lord, and hi own house, 8:2 that the
citi which huram had restor to solomon, solomon built them, and
caus the children of israel to dwell there.

8:3 and solomon went to hamathzobah, and prevail against it.

8:4 and he built tadmor in the wilderness, and all the store cities,
which he built in hamath.

8:5 also he built bethhoron the upper, and bethhoron the nether,
fenc cities, with walls, gates, and bars; 8:6 and baalath, and all
th store citi that solomon had, and all the chariot cities, and the
citi of the horsemen, and all that solomon desir to build in
jerusalem, and in lebanon, and throughout all the land of his
dominion.

8:7 As for all the peopl that were left of the hittites, and the
amorites, and the perizzites, and the hivites, and the jebusites,
which were not of israel, 8:8 but of their children, who were left
aft them in the land, whom the children of israel consum not, them
did solomon make to pay tribut until thi day.

8:9 but of the children of israel did solomon make no servant for his
work; but they were men of war, and chief of hi captains, and
captain of hi chariot and horsemen.

8:10 and these were the chief of king solomon' officers, even two
hundr and fifty, that bare rule over the people.

8:11 and solomon brought up the daughter of pharaoh out of the citi of
david unto the hous that he had built for her: for he said, My wife
shal not dwell in the hous of david king of israel, becaus the
plac are holy, whereunto the ark of the lord hath come.

8:12 then solomon offer burnt offer unto the lord on the altar
of the lord, which he had built befor the porch, 8:13 even after a
certain rate everi day, offer accord to the command of
moses, on the sabbaths, and on the new moons, and on the solemn
feasts, three time in the year, even in the feast of unleavened
bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tabernacles.

8:14 and he appointed, accord to the order of david hi father, the
cours of the priest to their service, and the levit to their
charges, to prais and minist befor the priests, as the duti of
everi day required: the porter also by their cours at everi gate:
for so had david the man of god commanded.

8:15 and they depart not from the command of the king unto the
priest and levit concern ani matter, or concern the
treasures.

8:16 now all the work of solomon wa prepar unto the day of the
found of the hous of the lord, and until it wa finished. So the
hous of the lord wa perfected.

8:17 then went solomon to eziongeber, and to eloth, at the sea side in
th land of edom.

8:18 and huram sent him by the hand of hi servant ships, and
serv that had knowledg of the sea; and they went with the
serv of solomon to ophir, and took thenc four hundr and fifty
tal of gold, and brought them to king solomon.

9:1 and when the queen of sheba heard of the fame of solomon, she came
to prove solomon with hard question at jerusalem, with a veri great
company, and camel that bare spices, and gold in abundance, and
preci stones: and when she wa come to solomon, she commun with
him of all that wa in her heart.

9:2 and solomon told her all her questions: and there wa noth hid
from solomon which he told her not.

9:3 and when the queen of sheba had seen the wisdom of solomon, and
th hous that he had built, 9:4 and the meat of hi table, and the
sit of hi servants, and the attend of hi ministers, and
their apparel; hi cupbear also, and their apparel; and hi ascent
bi which he went up into the hous of the lord; there wa no more
spirit in her.

9:5 and she said to the king, It wa a true report which I heard in
min own land of thine acts, and of thi wisdom: 9:6 howbeit I believed
not their words, until I came, and mine eye had seen it: and, behold,
th one half of the great of thi wisdom wa not told me: for thou
exceedest the fame that I heard.

9:7 happi are thi men, and happi are these thi servants, which stand
continu befor thee, and hear thi wisdom.

9:8 bless be the lord thi god, which delight in thee to set thee
on hi throne, to be king for the lord thi god: becaus thi god loved
israel, to establish them for ever, therefor made he thee king over
them, to do judgment and justice.

9:9 and she gave the king an hundr and twenti talent of gold, and
of spice great abundance, and preciou stones: neither wa there any
such spice as the queen of sheba gave king solomon.

9:10 and the servant also of huram, and the servant of solomon,
which brought gold from ophir, brought algum tree and precious
stones.

9:11 and the king made of the algum tree terrac to the hous of the
lord, and to the king' palace, and harp and psalteri for singers:
and there were none such seen befor in the land of judah.

9:12 and king solomon gave to the queen of sheba all her desire,
whatsoev she asked, besid that which she had brought unto the king.
so she turned, and went away to her own land, she and her servants.

9:13 now the weight of gold that came to solomon in one year wa six
hundr and threescor and six talent of gold; 9:14 besid that which
chapmen and merchant brought. and all the king of arabia and
governor of the countri brought gold and silver to solomon.

9:15 and king solomon made two hundr target of beaten gold: six
hundr shekel of beaten gold went to one target.

9:16 and three hundr shield made he of beaten gold: three hundred
shekel of gold went to one shield. and the king put them in the house
of the forest of lebanon.

9:17 moreov the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it
with pure gold.

9:18 and there were six step to the throne, with a footstool of gold,
which were fasten to the throne, and stay on each side of the
sit place, and two lion stand by the stays: 9:19 and twelve
lion stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps.
ther wa not the like made in ani kingdom.

9:20 and all the drink vessel of king solomon were of gold, and
al the vessel of the hous of the forest of lebanon were of pure
gold: none were of silver; it wa not ani thing account of in the
day of solomon.

9:21 for the king' ship went to tarshish with the servant of huram:
everi three year onc came the ship of tarshish bring gold, and
silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.

9:22 and king solomon pass all the king of the earth in rich and
wisdom.

9:23 and all the king of the earth sought the presenc of solomon, to
hear hi wisdom, that god had put in hi heart.

9:24 and they brought everi man hi present, vessel of silver, and
vessel of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules,
a rate year by year.

9:25 and solomon had four thousand stall for hors and chariots, and
twelv thousand horsemen; whom he bestow in the chariot cities, and
with the king at jerusalem.

9:26 and he reign over all the king from the river even unto the
land of the philistines, and to the border of egypt.

9:27 and the king made silver in jerusalem as stones, and cedar trees
mad he as the sycomor tree that are in the low plain in abundance.

9:28 and they brought unto solomon hors out of egypt, and out of all
lands.

9:29 now the rest of the act of solomon, first and last, are they not
written in the book of nathan the prophet, and in the propheci of
ahijah the shilonite, and in the vision of iddo the seer against
jeroboam the son of nebat?  9:30 and solomon reign in jerusalem over
al israel forti years.

9:31 and solomon slept with hi fathers, and he wa buri in the city
of david hi father: and rehoboam hi son reign in hi stead.

10:1 and rehoboam went to shechem: for to shechem were all israel come
to make him king.

10:2 and it came to pass, when jeroboam the son of nebat, who wa in
egypt, whither he fled from the presenc of solomon the king, heard
it, that jeroboam return out of egypt.

10:3 and they sent and call him. So jeroboam and all israel came and
spak to rehoboam, saying, 10:4 thi father made our yoke grievous: now
therefor eas thou somewhat the grievou servitud of thi father, and
hi heavi yoke that he put upon us, and we will serv thee.

10:5 and he said unto them, come again unto me after three days. and
th peopl departed.

10:6 and king rehoboam took counsel with the old men that had stood
befor solomon hi father while he yet lived, saying, what counsel
g ye me to return answer to thi people?  10:7 and they spake unto
him, saying, If thou be kind to thi people, and pleas them, and
speak good word to them, they will be thi servant for ever.

10:8 but he forsook the counsel which the old men gave him, and took
counsel with the young men that were brought up with him, that stood
befor him.

10:9 and he said unto them, what advic give ye that we may return
answ to thi people, which have spoken to me, saying, eas somewhat
th yoke that thi father did put upon us?  10:10 and the young men
that were brought up with him spake unto him, saying, thu shalt thou
answ the peopl that spake unto thee, saying, thi father made our
yok heavy, but make thou it somewhat lighter for us; thu shalt thou
say unto them, My littl finger shall be thicker than my father's
loins.

10:11 for wherea my father put a heavi yoke upon you, I will put more
to your yoke: my father chastis you with whips, but I will chastise
y with scorpions.

10:12 So jeroboam and all the peopl came to rehoboam on the third
day, as the king bade, saying, come again to me on the third day.

10:13 and the king answer them roughly; and king rehoboam forsook
th counsel of the old men, 10:14 and answer them after the advice
of the young men, saying, My father made your yoke heavy, but I will
add thereto: my father chastis you with whips, but I will chastise
y with scorpions.

10:15 So the king hearken not unto the people: for the caus wa of
god, that the lord might perform hi word, which he spake by the hand
of ahijah the shilonit to jeroboam the son of nebat.

10:16 and when all israel saw that the king would not hearken unto
them, the peopl answer the king, saying, what portion have we in
david?  and we have none inherit in the son of jesse: everi man to
your tents, O israel: and now, david, see to thine own house. So all
israel went to their tents.

10:17 but as for the children of israel that dwelt in the citi of
judah, rehoboam reign over them.

10:18 then king rehoboam sent hadoram that wa over the tribute; and
th children of israel stone him with stones, that he died. but king
rehoboam made speed to get him up to hi chariot, to flee to
jerusalem.

10:19 and israel rebel against the hous of david unto thi day.

11:1 and when rehoboam wa come to jerusalem, he gather of the house
of judah and benjamin an hundr and fourscor thousand chosen men,
which were warriors, to fight against israel, that he might bring the
kingdom again to rehoboam.

11:2 but the word of the lord came to shemaiah the man of god, saying,
11:3 speak unto rehoboam the son of solomon, king of judah, and to all
israel in judah and benjamin, saying, 11:4 thu saith the lord, ye
shal not go up, nor fight against your brethren: return everi man to
hi house: for thi thing is done of me. and they obey the word of
th lord, and return from go against jeroboam.

11:5 and rehoboam dwelt in jerusalem, and built citi for defenc in
judah.

11:6 He built even bethlehem, and etam, and tekoa, 11:7 and bethzur,
and shoco, and adullam, 11:8 and gath, and mareshah, and ziph, 11:9
and adoraim, and lachish, and azekah, 11:10 and zorah, and aijalon,
and hebron, which are in judah and in benjamin fenc cities.

11:11 and he fortifi the strong holds, and put captain in them, and
stor of victual, and of oil and wine.

11:12 and in everi sever citi he put shield and spears, and made
them exceed strong, have judah and benjamin on hi side.

11:13 and the priest and the levit that were in all israel resorted
to him out of all their coasts.

11:14 for the levit left their suburb and their possession, and
cam to judah and jerusalem: for jeroboam and hi son had cast them
off from execut the priest' offic unto the lord: 11:15 and he
ordain him priest for the high places, and for the devils, and for
th calv which he had made.

11:16 and after them out of all the tribe of israel such as set their
heart to seek the lord god of israel came to jerusalem, to sacrifice
unto the lord god of their fathers.

11:17 So they strengthen the kingdom of judah, and made rehoboam the
son of solomon strong, three years: for three year they walk in the
way of david and solomon.

11:18 and rehoboam took him mahalath the daughter of jerimoth the son
of david to wife, and abihail the daughter of eliab the son of jesse;
11:19 which bare him children; jeush, and shamariah, and zaham.

11:20 and after her he took maachah the daughter of absalom; which
bar him abijah, and attai, and ziza, and shelomith.

11:21 and rehoboam love maachah the daughter of absalom abov all his
wiv and hi concubines: (for he took eighteen wives, and threescore
concubines; and begat twenti and eight sons, and threescore
daughters.)  11:22 and rehoboam made abijah the son of maachah the
chief, to be ruler among hi brethren: for he thought to make him
king.

11:23 and he dealt wisely, and dispers of all hi children
throughout all the countri of judah and benjamin, unto everi fenced
city: and he gave them victual in abundance. and he desir many
wives.

12:1 and it came to pass, when rehoboam had establish the kingdom,
and had strengthen himself, he forsook the law of the lord, and all
israel with him.

12:2 and it came to pass, that in the fifth year of king rehoboam
shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem, becaus they had
transgress against the lord, 12:3 with twelv hundr chariots, and
threescor thousand horsemen: and the peopl were without number that
cam with him out of egypt; the lubims, the sukkiims, and the
ethiopians.

12:4 and he took the fenc citi which pertain to judah, and came
to jerusalem.

12:5 then came shemaiah the prophet to rehoboam, and to the princ of
judah, that were gather togeth to jerusalem becaus of shishak,
and said unto them, thu saith the lord, Ye have forsaken me, and
therefor have I also left you in the hand of shishak.

12:6 whereupon the princ of israel and the king humbl themselves;
and they said, the lord is righteous.

12:7 and when the lord saw that they humbl themselves, the word of
th lord came to shemaiah, saying, they have humbl themselves;
therefor I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some
