deliverance; and my wrath shall not be pour out upon jerusalem by
th hand of shishak.

12:8 nevertheless they shall be hi servants; that they may know my
service, and the servic of the kingdom of the countries.

12:9 So shishak king of egypt came up against jerusalem, and took away
th treasur of the hous of the lord, and the treasur of the
king' house; he took all: he carri away also the shield of gold
which solomon had made.

12:10 instead of which king rehoboam made shield of brass, and
commit them to the hand of the chief of the guard, that kept the
entr of the king' house.

12:11 and when the king enter into the hous of the lord, the guard
cam and fetch them, and brought them again into the guard chamber.

12:12 and when he humbl himself, the wrath of the lord turn from
him, that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in judah
th went well.

12:13 So king rehoboam strengthen himself in jerusalem, and reigned:
for rehoboam wa one and forti year old when he began to reign, and
h reign seventeen year in jerusalem, the citi which the lord had
chosen out of all the tribe of israel, to put hi name there. and his
mother' name wa naamah an ammonitess.

12:14 and he did evil, becaus he prepar not hi heart to seek the
lord.

12:15 now the act of rehoboam, first and last, are they not written
in the book of shemaiah the prophet, and of iddo the seer concerning
genealogies? and there were war between rehoboam and jeroboam
continually.

12:16 and rehoboam slept with hi fathers, and wa buri in the city
of david: and abijah hi son reign in hi stead.

13:1 now in the eighteenth year of king jeroboam began abijah to reign
ov judah.

13:2 He reign three year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also was
michaiah the daughter of uriel of gibeah. and there wa war between
abijah and jeroboam.

13:3 and abijah set the battl in array with an armi of valiant men of
war, even four hundr thousand chosen men: jeroboam also set the
battl in array against him with eight hundr thousand chosen men,
b mighti men of valour.

13:4 and abijah stood up upon mount zemaraim, which is in mount
ephraim, and said, hear me, thou jeroboam, and all israel; 13:5 ought
y not to know that the lord god of israel gave the kingdom over
israel to david for ever, even to him and to hi son by a coven of
salt?  13:6 yet jeroboam the son of nebat, the servant of solomon the
son of david, is risen up, and hath rebel against hi lord.

13:7 and there are gather unto him vain men, the children of belial,
and have strengthen themselv against rehoboam the son of solomon,
when rehoboam wa young and tenderhearted, and could not withstand
them.

13:8 and now ye think to withstand the kingdom of the lord in the hand
of the son of david; and ye be a great multitude, and there are with
your golden calves, which jeroboam made you for gods.

13:9 have ye not cast out the priest of the lord, the son of aaron,
and the levites, and have made you priest after the manner of the
nat of other lands? so that whosoev cometh to consecr himself
with a young bullock and seven rams, the same may be a priest of them
that are no gods.

13:10 but as for us, the lord is our god, and we have not forsaken
him; and the priests, which minist unto the lord, are the son of
aaron, and the levit wait upon their business: 13:11 and they burn
unto the lord everi morn and everi even burnt sacrific and
sweet incense: the shewbread also set they in order upon the pure
table; and the candlestick of gold with the lamp thereof, to burn
everi evening: for we keep the charg of the lord our god; but ye have
forsaken him.

13:12 and, behold, god himself is with us for our captain, and his
priest with sound trumpet to cri alarm against you. O children of
israel, fight ye not against the lord god of your fathers; for ye
shal not prosper.

13:13 but jeroboam caus an ambush to come about behind them: so
they were befor judah, and the ambush wa behind them.

13:14 and when judah look back, behold, the battl wa befor and
behind: and they cri unto the lord, and the priest sound with the
trumpets.

13:15 then the men of judah gave a shout: and as the men of judah
shouted, it came to pass, that god smote jeroboam and all israel
befor abijah and judah.

13:16 and the children of israel fled befor judah: and god delivered
them into their hand.

13:17 and abijah and hi peopl slew them with a great slaughter: so
ther fell down slain of israel five hundr thousand chosen men.

13:18 thu the children of israel were brought under at that time, and
th children of judah prevailed, becaus they reli upon the lord god
of their fathers.

13:19 and abijah pursu after jeroboam, and took citi from him,
bethel with the town thereof, and jeshanah with the town thereof,
and ephraim with the town thereof.

13:20 neither did jeroboam recov strength again in the day of
abijah: and the lord struck him, and he died.

13:21 but abijah wax mighty, and marri fourteen wives, and begat
twenti and two sons, and sixteen daughters.

13:22 and the rest of the act of abijah, and hi ways, and his
sayings, are written in the stori of the prophet iddo.

14:1 So abijah slept with hi fathers, and they buri him in the city
of david: and asa hi son reign in hi stead. In hi day the land
wa quiet ten years.

14:2 and asa did that which wa good and right in the eye of the lord
hi god: 14:3 for he took away the altar of the strang gods, and the
high places, and brake down the images, and cut down the groves: 14:4
and command judah to seek the lord god of their fathers, and to do
th law and the commandment.

14:5 also he took away out of all the citi of judah the high places
and the images: and the kingdom wa quiet befor him.

14:6 and he built fenc citi in judah: for the land had rest, and
h had no war in those years; becaus the lord had given him rest.

14:7 therefor he said unto judah, let us build these cities, and make
about them walls, and towers, gates, and bars, while the land is yet
befor us; becaus we have sought the lord our god, we have sought
him, and he hath given us rest on everi side. So they built and
prospered.

14:8 and asa had an armi of men that bare target and spears, out of
judah three hundr thousand; and out of benjamin, that bare shields
and drew bows, two hundr and fourscor thousand: all these were
mighti men of valour.

14:9 and there came out against them zerah the ethiopian with an host
of a thousand thousand, and three hundr chariots; and came unto
mareshah.

14:10 then asa went out against him, and they set the battl in array
in the valley of zephathah at mareshah.

14:11 and asa cri unto the lord hi god, and said, lord, it is
noth with thee to help, whether with many, or with them that have
no power: help us, O lord our god; for we rest on thee, and in thy
nam we go against thi multitude. O lord, thou art our god; let no
man prevail against thee.

14:12 So the lord smote the ethiopian befor asa, and befor judah;
and the ethiopian fled.

14:13 and asa and the peopl that were with him pursu them unto
gerar: and the ethiopian were overthrown, that they could not recover
themselves; for they were destroy befor the lord, and befor his
host; and they carri away veri much spoil.

14:14 and they smote all the citi round about gerar; for the fear of
th lord came upon them: and they spoil all the cities; for there
wa exceed much spoil in them.

14:15 they smote also the tent of cattle, and carri away sheep and
camel in abundance, and return to jerusalem.

15:1 and the spirit of god came upon azariah the son of oded: 15:2 and
h went out to meet asa, and said unto him, hear ye me, asa, and all
judah and benjamin; the lord is with you, while ye be with him; and if
y seek him, he will be found of you; but if ye forsak him, he will
forsak you.

15:3 now for a long season israel hath been without the true god, and
without a teach priest, and without law.

15:4 but when they in their troubl did turn unto the lord god of
israel, and sought him, he wa found of them.

15:5 and in those time there wa no peac to him that went out, nor
to him that came in, but great vexat were upon all the inhabitants
of the countries.

15:6 and nation wa destroy of nation, and citi of city: for god did
vex them with all adversity.

15:7 Be ye strong therefore, and let not your hand be weak: for your
work shall be rewarded.

15:8 and when asa heard these words, and the propheci of ode the
prophet, he took courage, and put away the abomin idol out of all
th land of judah and benjamin, and out of the citi which he had
taken from mount ephraim, and renew the altar of the lord, that was
befor the porch of the lord.

15:9 and he gather all judah and benjamin, and the stranger with
them out of ephraim and manasseh, and out of simeon: for they fell to
him out of israel in abundance, when they saw that the lord hi god
wa with him.

15:10 So they gather themselv togeth at jerusalem in the third
month, in the fifteenth year of the reign of asa.

15:11 and they offer unto the lord the same time, of the spoil which
they had brought, seven hundr oxen and seven thousand sheep.

15:12 and they enter into a coven to seek the lord god of their
fath with all their heart and with all their soul; 15:13 that
whosoev would not seek the lord god of israel should be put to
death, whether small or great, whether man or woman.

15:14 and they sware unto the lord with a loud voice, and with
shouting, and with trumpets, and with cornets.

15:15 and all judah rejoic at the oath: for they had sworn with all
their heart, and sought him with their whole desire; and he wa found
of them: and the lord gave them rest round about.

15:16 and also concern maachah the mother of asa the king, he
remov her from be queen, becaus she had made an idol in a grove:
and asa cut down her idol, and stamp it, and burnt it at the brook
kidron.

15:17 but the high place were not taken away out of israel:
nevertheless the heart of asa wa perfect all hi days.

15:18 and he brought into the hous of god the thing that hi father
had dedicated, and that he himself had dedicated, silver, and gold,
and vessels.

15:19 and there wa no more war unto the five and thirtieth year of
th reign of asa.

16:1 In the six and thirtieth year of the reign of asa baasha king of
israel came up against judah, and built ramah, to the intent that he
might let none go out or come in to asa king of judah.

16:2 then asa brought out silver and gold out of the treasur of the
hous of the lord and of the king' house, and sent to benhadad king
of syria, that dwelt at damascus, saying, 16:3 there is a league
between me and thee, as there wa between my father and thi father:
behold, I have sent thee silver and gold; go, break thi leagu with
baasha king of israel, that he may depart from me.

16:4 and benhadad hearken unto king asa, and sent the captain of
hi armi against the citi of israel; and they smote ijon, and dan,
and abelmaim, and all the store citi of naphtali.

16:5 and it came to pass, when baasha heard it, that he left off
build of ramah, and let hi work cease.

16:6 then asa the king took all judah; and they carri away the
ston of ramah, and the timber thereof, wherewith baasha was
building; and he built therewith geba and mizpah.

16:7 and at that time hanani the seer came to asa king of judah, and
said unto him, becaus thou hast reli on the king of syria, and not
r on the lord thi god, therefor is the host of the king of syria
escap out of thine hand.

16:8 were not the ethiopian and the lubim a huge host, with very
mani chariot and horsemen? yet, becaus thou didst reli on the lord,
h deliv them into thine hand.

16:9 for the eye of the lord run to and fro throughout the whole
earth, to shew himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is
perfect toward him. herein thou hast done foolishly: therefor from
henceforth thou shalt have wars.

16:10 then asa wa wroth with the seer, and put him in a prison house;
for he wa in a rage with him becaus of thi thing. and asa oppressed
som of the peopl the same time.

16:11 and, behold, the act of asa, first and last, lo, they are
written in the book of the king of judah and israel.

16:12 and asa in the thirti and ninth year of hi reign wa diseased
in hi feet, until hi diseas wa exceed great: yet in hi disease
h sought not to the lord, but to the physicians.

16:13 and asa slept with hi fathers, and die in the one and fortieth
year of hi reign.

16:14 and they buri him in hi own sepulchres, which he had made for
himself in the citi of david, and laid him in the bed which wa filled
with sweet odour and diver kind of spice prepar by the
apothecaries' art: and they made a veri great burn for him.

17:1 and jehoshaphat hi son reign in hi stead, and strengthened
himself against israel.

17:2 and he place forc in all the fenc citi of judah, and set
garrison in the land of judah, and in the citi of ephraim, which
asa hi father had taken.

17:3 and the lord wa with jehoshaphat, becaus he walk in the first
way of hi father david, and sought not unto baalim; 17:4 but sought
to the lord god of hi father, and walk in hi commandments, and not
aft the do of israel.

17:5 therefor the lord stablish the kingdom in hi hand; and all
judah brought to jehoshaphat presents; and he had rich and honour in
abundance.

17:6 and hi heart wa lift up in the way of the lord: moreov he
took away the high place and grove out of judah.

17:7 also in the third year of hi reign he sent to hi princes, even
to benhail, and to obadiah, and to zechariah, and to nethaneel, and to
michaiah, to teach in the citi of judah.

17:8 and with them he sent levites, even shemaiah, and nethaniah, and
zebadiah, and asahel, and shemiramoth, and jehonathan, and adonijah,
and tobijah, and tobadonijah, levites; and with them elishama and
jehoram, priests.

17:9 and they taught in judah, and had the book of the law of the lord
with them, and went about throughout all the citi of judah, and
taught the people.

17:10 and the fear of the lord fell upon all the kingdom of the lands
that were round about judah, so that they made no war against
jehoshaphat.

17:11 also some of the philistin brought jehoshaphat presents, and
tribut silver; and the arabian brought him flocks, seven thousand
and seven hundr rams, and seven thousand and seven hundr he goats.

17:12 and jehoshaphat wax great exceedingly; and he built in judah
castles, and citi of store.

17:13 and he had much busi in the citi of judah: and the men of
war, mighti men of valour, were in jerusalem.

17:14 and these are the number of them accord to the hous of
their fathers: Of judah, the captain of thousands; adnah the chief,
and with him mighti men of valour three hundr thousand.

17:15 and next to him wa jehohanan the captain, and with him two
hundr and fourscor thousand.

17:16 and next him wa amasiah the son of zichri, who willingly
off himself unto the lord; and with him two hundr thousand
mighti men of valour.

17:17 and of benjamin; eliada a mighti man of valour, and with him
arm men with bow and shield two hundr thousand.

17:18 and next him wa jehozabad, and with him an hundr and
fourscor thousand readi prepar for the war.

17:19 these wait on the king, besid those whom the king put in the
fenc citi throughout all judah.

18:1 now jehoshaphat had rich and honour in abundance, and joined
affin with ahab.

18:2 and after certain year he went down to ahab to samaria. and ahab
kil sheep and oxen for him in abundance, and for the peopl that he
had with him, and persuad him to go up with him to ramothgilead.

18:3 and ahab king of israel said unto jehoshaphat king of judah, wilt
thou go with me to ramothgilead? and he answer him, I am as thou
art, and my peopl as thi people; and we will be with thee in the war.

18:4 and jehoshaphat said unto the king of israel, enquire, I pray
thee, at the word of the lord to day.

18:5 therefor the king of israel gather togeth of prophet four
hundr men, and said unto them, shall we go to ramothgilead to
battle, or shall I forbear? and they said, Go up; for god will deliver
it into the king' hand.

18:6 but jehoshaphat said, Is there not here a prophet of the lord
besides, that we might enquir of him?  18:7 and the king of israel
said unto jehoshaphat, there is yet one man, by whom we may enquir of
th lord: but I hate him; for he never prophesi good unto me, but
alway evil: the same is micaiah the son of imla. and jehoshaphat
said, let not the king say so.

18:8 and the king of israel call for one of hi officers, and said,
fetch quickli micaiah the son of imla.

18:9 and the king of israel and jehoshaphat king of judah sat either
of them on hi throne, cloth in their robes, and they sat in a void
plac at the enter in of the gate of samaria; and all the prophets
prophesi befor them.

18:10 and zedekiah the son of chenaanah had made him horn of iron,
and said, thu saith the lord, with these thou shalt push syria until
they be consumed.

18:11 and all the prophet prophesi so, saying, Go up to
ramothgilead, and prosper: for the lord shall deliv it into the hand
of the king.

18:12 and the messeng that went to call micaiah spake to him,
saying, behold, the word of the prophet declar good to the king
with one assent; let thi word therefore, I pray thee, be like one of
their's, and speak thou good.

18:13 and micaiah said, As the lord liveth, even what my god saith,
that will I speak.

18:14 and when he wa come to the king, the king said unto him,
micaiah, shall we go to ramothgilead to battle, or shall I forbear?
and he said, Go ye up, and prosper, and they shall be deliv into
your hand.

18:15 and the king said to him, how mani time shall I adjur thee
that thou say noth but the truth to me in the name of the lord?
18:16 then he said, I did see all israel scatter upon the mountains,
a sheep that have no shepherd: and the lord said, these have no
master; let them return therefor everi man to hi hous in peace.

18:17 and the king of israel said to jehoshaphat, did I not tell thee
that he would not prophesi good unto me, but evil?  18:18 again he
said, therefor hear the word of the lord; I saw the lord sit upon
hi throne, and all the host of heaven stand on hi right hand and
on hi left.

18:19 and the lord said, who shall entic ahab king of israel, that he
may go up and fall at ramothgilead? and one spake say after this
manner, and anoth say after that manner.

18:20 then there came out a spirit, and stood befor the lord, and
said, I will entic him. and the lord said unto him, wherewith?  18:21
and he said, I will go out, and be a lie spirit in the mouth of all
hi prophets. and the lord said, thou shalt entic him, and thou shalt
also prevail: go out, and do even so.

18:22 now therefore, behold, the lord hath put a lie spirit in the
mouth of these thi prophets, and the lord hath spoken evil against
thee.

18:23 then zedekiah the son of chenaanah came near, and smote micaiah
upon the cheek, and said, which way went the spirit of the lord from
m to speak unto thee?  18:24 and micaiah said, behold, thou shalt see
on that day when thou shalt go into an inner chamber to hide thyself.

18:25 then the king of israel said, take ye micaiah, and carri him
back to amon the governor of the city, and to joash the king' son;
18:26 and say, thu saith the king, put thi fellow in the prison, and
fe him with bread of afflict and with water of affliction, until
i return in peace.

18:27 and micaiah said, If thou certainli return in peace, then hath
not the lord spoken by me. and he said, hearken, all ye people.

18:28 So the king of israel and jehoshaphat the king of judah went up
to ramothgilead.

18:29 and the king of israel said unto jehoshaphat, I will disguise
myself, and I will go to the battle; but put thou on thi robes. So the
k of israel disguis himself; and they went to the battle.

18:30 now the king of syria had command the captain of the chariots
that were with him, saying, fight ye not with small or great, save
onli with the king of israel.

18:31 and it came to pass, when the captain of the chariot saw
jehoshaphat, that they said, It is the king of israel. therefor they
compass about him to fight: but jehoshaphat cri out, and the lord
help him; and god move them to depart from him.

18:32 for it came to pass, that, when the captain of the chariots
perceiv that it wa not the king of israel, they turn back again
from pursu him.

18:33 and a certain man drew a bow at a venture, and smote the king of
israel between the joint of the harness: therefor he said to his
chariot man, turn thine hand, that thou mayest carri me out of the
host; for I am wounded.

18:34 and the battl increas that day: howbeit the king of israel
stay himself up in hi chariot against the syrian until the even:
and about the time of the sun go down he died.

19:1 and jehoshaphat the king of judah return to hi hous in peace
to jerusalem.

19:2 and jehu the son of hanani the seer went out to meet him, and
said to king jehoshaphat, shouldest thou help the ungodly, and love
them that hate the lord? therefor is wrath upon thee from befor the
lord.

19:3 nevertheless there are good thing found in thee, in that thou
hast taken away the grove out of the land, and hast prepar thine
heart to seek god.

19:4 and jehoshaphat dwelt at jerusalem: and he went out again through
th peopl from beersheba to mount ephraim, and brought them back unto
th lord god of their fathers.

19:5 and he set judg in the land throughout all the fenc citi of
judah, citi by city, 19:6 and said to the judges, take heed what ye
do: for ye judg not for man, but for the lord, who is with you in the
judgment.

19:7 wherefor now let the fear of the lord be upon you; take heed and
do it: for there is no iniqu with the lord our god, nor respect of
persons, nor take of gifts.

19:8 moreov in jerusalem did jehoshaphat set of the levites, and of
th priests, and of the chief of the father of israel, for the
judg of the lord, and for controversies, when they return to
jerusalem.

19:9 and he charg them, saying, thu shall ye do in the fear of the
lord, faithfully, and with a perfect heart.

19:10 and what caus soever shall come to you of your brethren that
dwel in your cities, between blood and blood, between law and
commandment, statut and judgments, ye shall even warn them that they
trespass not against the lord, and so wrath come upon you, and upon
your brethren: thi do, and ye shall not trespass.

19:11 and, behold, amariah the chief priest is over you in all matters
of the lord; and zebadiah the son of ishmael, the ruler of the house
of judah, for all the king' matters: also the levit shall be
offic befor you. deal courageously, and the lord shall be with the
good.

20:1 It came to pass after thi also, that the children of moab, and
th children of ammon, and with them other besid the ammonites, came
against jehoshaphat to battle.

20:2 then there came some that told jehoshaphat, saying, there cometh
a great multitud against thee from beyond the sea on thi side syria;
and, behold, they be in hazazontamar, which is engedi.

20:3 and jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the lord, and
proclaim a fast throughout all judah.

20:4 and judah gather themselv together, to ask help of the lord:
even out of all the citi of judah they came to seek the lord.

20:5 and jehoshaphat stood in the congreg of judah and jerusalem,
in the hous of the lord, befor the new court, 20:6 and said, O lord
god of our fathers, art not thou god in heaven? and rulest not thou
ov all the kingdom of the heathen? and in thine hand is there not
pow and might, so that none is abl to withstand thee?  20:7 art not
thou our god, who didst drive out the inhabit of thi land before
thi peopl israel, and gavest it to the seed of abraham thi friend for
ever?  20:8 and they dwelt therein, and have built thee a sanctuary
therein for thi name, saying, 20:9 if, when evil cometh upon us, as
th sword, judgment, or pestilence, or famine, we stand befor this
house, and in thi presence, (for thi name is in thi house,) and cry
unto thee in our affliction, then thou wilt hear and help.

20:10 and now, behold, the children of ammon and moab and mount seir,
whom thou wouldest not let israel invade, when they came out of the
land of egypt, but they turn from them, and destroy them not;
20:11 behold, I say, how they reward us, to come to cast us out of thy
possession, which thou hast given us to inherit.

20:12 O our god, wilt thou not judg them? for we have no might
against thi great compani that cometh against us; neither know we
what to do: but our eye are upon thee.

20:13 and all judah stood befor the lord, with their littl ones,
their wives, and their children.

20:14 then upon jahaziel the son of zechariah, the son of benaiah, the
son of jeiel, the son of mattaniah, a levit of the son of asaph,
cam the spirit of the lord in the midst of the congregation; 20:15
and he said, hearken ye, all judah, and ye inhabit of jerusalem,
and thou king jehoshaphat, thu saith the lord unto you, Be not afraid
nor dismay by reason of thi great multitude; for the battl is not
yours, but god's.

20:16 To morrow go ye down against them: behold, they come up by the
cliff of ziz; and ye shall find them at the end of the brook, before
th wilder of jeruel.

20:17 Ye shall not need to fight in thi battle: set yourselves, stand
y still, and see the salvat of the lord with you, O judah and
jerusalem: fear not, nor be dismayed; to morrow go out against them:
for the lord will be with you.

20:18 and jehoshaphat bow hi head with hi face to the ground: and
al judah and the inhabit of jerusalem fell befor the lord,
worship the lord.

20:19 and the levites, of the children of the kohathites, and of the
children of the korhites, stood up to prais the lord god of israel
with a loud voic on high.

20:20 and they rose earli in the morning, and went forth into the
wild of tekoa: and as they went forth, jehoshaphat stood and
said, hear me, O judah, and ye inhabit of jerusalem; believ in
th lord your god, so shall ye be established; believ hi prophets,
so shall ye prosper.

20:21 and when he had consult with the people, he appoint singers
unto the lord, and that should prais the beauti of holiness, as they
went out befor the army, and to say, prais the lord; for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

20:22 and when they began to sing and to praise, the lord set
ambush against the children of ammon, moab, and mount seir, which
wer come against judah; and they were smitten.

20:23 for the children of ammon and moab stood up against the
inhabit of mount seir, utterli to slay and destroy them: and when
they had made an end of the inhabit of seir, everi one help to
destroy another.

20:24 and when judah came toward the watch tower in the wilderness,
they look unto the multitude, and, behold, they were dead bodies
fallen to the earth, and none escaped.

20:25 and when jehoshaphat and hi peopl came to take away the spoil
of them, they found among them in abund both rich with the dead
bodies, and preciou jewels, which they strip off for themselves,
mor than they could carri away: and they were three day in gathering
of the spoil, it wa so much.

20:26 and on the fourth day they assembl themselv in the valley of
berachah; for there they bless the lord: therefor the name of the
sam place wa called, the valley of berachah, unto thi day.

20:27 then they returned, everi man of judah and jerusalem, and
jehoshaphat in the forefront of them, to go again to jerusalem with
joy; for the lord had made them to rejoic over their enemies.

20:28 and they came to jerusalem with psalteri and harp and
trumpet unto the hous of the lord.

20:29 and the fear of god wa on all the kingdom of those countries,
when they had heard that the lord fought against the enemi of
israel.

20:30 So the realm of jehoshaphat wa quiet: for hi god gave him rest
round about.

20:31 and jehoshaphat reign over judah: he wa thirti and five years
old when he began to reign, and he reign twenti and five year in
jerusalem.

and hi mother' name wa azubah the daughter of shilhi.

20:32 and he walk in the way of asa hi father, and depart not
from it, do that which wa right in the sight of the lord.

20:33 howbeit the high place were not taken away: for as yet the
peopl had not prepar their heart unto the god of their fathers.

20:34 now the rest of the act of jehoshaphat, first and last, behold,
they are written in the book of jehu the son of hanani, who is
ment in the book of the king of israel.

20:35 and after thi did jehoshaphat king of judah join himself with
ahaziah king of israel, who did veri wickedly: 20:36 and he joined
himself with him to make ship to go to tarshish: and they made the
ship in eziongaber.

20:37 then eliez the son of dodavah of mareshah prophesi against
jehoshaphat, saying, becaus thou hast join thyself with ahaziah,
th lord hath broken thi works. and the ship were broken, that they
wer not abl to go to tarshish.

21:1 now jehoshaphat slept with hi fathers, and wa buri with his
fath in the citi of david. and jehoram hi son reign in his
stead.

21:2 and he had brethren the son of jehoshaphat, azariah, and jehiel,
and zechariah, and azariah, and michael, and shephatiah: all these
wer the son of jehoshaphat king of israel.

21:3 and their father gave them great gift of silver, and of gold,
and of preciou things, with fenc citi in judah: but the kingdom
gav he to jehoram; becaus he wa the firstborn.

21:4 now when jehoram wa risen up to the kingdom of hi father, he
strengthen himself, and slew all hi brethren with the sword, and
div also of the princ of israel.

21:5 jehoram wa thirti and two year old when he began to reign, and
h reign eight year in jerusalem.

21:6 and he walk in the way of the king of israel, like as did the
hous of ahab: for he had the daughter of ahab to wife: and he wrought
that which wa evil in the eye of the lord.

21:7 howbeit the lord would not destroy the hous of david, becaus of
th coven that he had made with david, and as he promis to give a
light to him and to hi son for ever.

21:8 In hi day the edomit revolt from under the dominion of
judah, and made themselv a king.

21:9 then jehoram went forth with hi princes, and all hi chariots
with him: and he rose up by night, and smote the edomit which
compass him in, and the captain of the chariots.

21:10 So the edomit revolt from under the hand of judah unto this
day.

th same time also did libnah revolt from under hi hand; becaus he
had forsaken the lord god of hi fathers.

21:11 moreov he made high place in the mountain of judah and
caus the inhabit of jerusalem to commit fornication, and
compel judah thereto.

21:12 and there came a write to him from elijah the prophet, saying,
thu saith the lord god of david thi father, becaus thou hast not
walk in the way of jehoshaphat thi father, nor in the way of asa
k of judah, 21:13 but hast walk in the way of the king of
israel, and hast made judah and the inhabit of jerusalem to go a
whoring, like to the whoredom of the hous of ahab, and also hast
slain thi brethren of thi father' house, which were better than
thyself: 21:14 behold, with a great plagu will the lord smite thy
people, and thi children, and thi wives, and all thi goods: 21:15 and
thou shalt have great sick by diseas of thi bowels, until thy
bowel fall out by reason of the sick day by day.

21:16 moreov the lord stir up against jehoram the spirit of the
philistines, and of the arabians, that were near the ethiopians: 21:17
and they came up into judah, and brake into it, and carri away all
th substanc that wa found in the king' house, and hi son also,
and hi wives; so that there wa never a son left him, save jehoahaz,
th youngest of hi sons.

21:18 and after all thi the lord smote him in hi bowel with an
incur disease.

21:19 and it came to pass, that in process of time, after the end of
two years, hi bowel fell out by reason of hi sickness: so he died
of sore diseases. and hi peopl made no burn for him, like the
burn of hi fathers.

21:20 thirti and two year old wa he when he began to reign, and he
reign in jerusalem eight years, and depart without be desired.
howbeit they buri him in the citi of david, but not in the
sepulchr of the kings.

22:1 and the inhabit of jerusalem made ahaziah hi youngest son
k in hi stead: for the band of men that came with the arabian to
th camp had slain all the eldest. So ahaziah the son of jehoram king
of judah reigned.

22:2 forti and two year old wa ahaziah when he began to reign, and
h reign one year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also wa athaliah
th daughter of omri.

22:3 He also walk in the way of the hous of ahab: for hi mother
wa hi counsellor to do wickedly.

22:4 wherefor he did evil in the sight of the lord like the hous of
ahab: for they were hi counsellor after the death of hi father to
hi destruction.

22:5 He walk also after their counsel, and went with jehoram the son
of ahab king of israel to war against hazael king of syria at
ramothgilead: and the syrian smote joram.

22:6 and he return to be heal in jezreel becaus of the wounds
which were given him at ramah, when he fought with hazael king of
syria. and azariah the son of jehoram king of judah went down to see
jehoram the son of ahab at jezreel, becaus he wa sick.

22:7 and the destruct of ahaziah wa of god by come to joram: for
when he wa come, he went out with jehoram against jehu the son of
nimshi, whom the lord had anoint to cut off the hous of ahab.

22:8 and it came to pass, that, when jehu wa execut judgment upon
th hous of ahab, and found the princ of judah, and the son of the
brethren of ahaziah, that minist to ahaziah, he slew them.

22:9 and he sought ahaziah: and they caught him, (for he wa hid in
samaria,) and brought him to jehu: and when they had slain him, they
buri him: because, said they, he is the son of jehoshaphat, who
sought the lord with all hi heart. So the hous of ahaziah had no
pow to keep still the kingdom.

22:10 but when athaliah the mother of ahaziah saw that her son was
dead, she aros and destroy all the seed royal of the hous of
judah.

22:11 but jehoshabeath, the daughter of the king, took joash the son
of ahaziah, and stole him from among the king' son that were slain,
and put him and hi nurs in a bedchamber. So jehoshabeath, the
daught of king jehoram, the wife of jehoiada the priest, (for she
wa the sister of ahaziah,) hid him from athaliah, so that she slew
him not.

22:12 and he wa with them hid in the hous of god six years: and
athaliah reign over the land.

23:1 and in the seventh year jehoiada strengthen himself, and took
th captain of hundreds, azariah the son of jeroham, and ishmael the
son of jehohanan, and azariah the son of obed, and maaseiah the son of
adaiah, and elishaphat the son of zichri, into coven with him.

23:2 and they went about in judah, and gather the levit out of all
th citi of judah, and the chief of the father of israel, and they
cam to jerusalem.

23:3 and all the congreg made a coven with the king in the
hous of god. and he said unto them, behold, the king' son shall
reign, as the lord hath said of the son of david.

23:4 thi is the thing that ye shall do; A third part of you entering
on the sabbath, of the priest and of the levites, shall be porter of
th doors; 23:5 and a third part shall be at the king' house; and a
third part at the gate of the foundation: and all the peopl shall be
in the court of the hous of the lord.

23:6 but let none come into the hous of the lord, save the priests,
and they that minist of the levites; they shall go in, for they are
holy: but all the peopl shall keep the watch of the lord.

23:7 and the levit shall compass the king round about, everi man
with hi weapon in hi hand; and whosoev els cometh into the
house, he shall be put to death: but be ye with the king when he
cometh in, and when he goeth out.

23:8 So the levit and all judah did accord to all thing that
jehoiada the priest had commanded, and took everi man hi men that
wer to come in on the sabbath, with them that were to go out on the
sabbath: for jehoiada the priest dismiss not the courses.

23:9 moreov jehoiada the priest deliv to the captain of
hundr spears, and bucklers, and shields, that had been king
david's, which were in the hous of god.

23:10 and he set all the people, everi man have hi weapon in his
hand, from the right side of the templ to the left side of the
temple, along by the altar and the temple, by the king round about.

23:11 then they brought out the king' son, and put upon him the
crown, and gave him the testimony, and made him king. and jehoiada and
hi son anoint him, and said, god save the king.

23:12 now when athaliah heard the nois of the peopl run and
prais the king, she came to the peopl into the hous of the lord:
23:13 and she looked, and, behold, the king stood at hi pillar at the
ent in, and the princ and the trumpet by the king: and all the
peopl of the land rejoiced, and sound with trumpets, also the
sing with instrument of musick, and such as taught to sing praise.
then athaliah rent her clothes, and said, treason, treason.

23:14 then jehoiada the priest brought out the captain of hundreds
that were set over the host, and said unto them, have her forth of the
ranges: and whoso followeth her, let him be slain with the sword. for
th priest said, slay her not in the hous of the lord.

23:15 So they laid hand on her; and when she wa come to the entering
of the hors gate by the king' house, they slew her there.

23:16 and jehoiada made a coven between him, and between all the
people, and between the king, that they should be the lord' people.

23:17 then all the peopl went to the hous of baal, and brake it
down, and brake hi altar and hi imag in pieces, and slew mattan
th priest of baal befor the altars.

23:18 also jehoiada appoint the offic of the hous of the lord by
th hand of the priest the levites, whom david had distribut in the
hous of the lord, to offer the burnt offer of the lord, as it is
written in the law of moses, with rejoic and with singing, as it
wa ordain by david.

23:19 and he set the porter at the gate of the hous of the lord,
that none which wa unclean in ani thing should enter in.

23:20 and he took the captain of hundreds, and the nobles, and the
governor of the people, and all the peopl of the land, and brought
down the king from the hous of the lord: and they came through the
high gate into the king' house, and set the king upon the throne of
th kingdom.

23:21 and all the peopl of the land rejoiced: and the citi wa quiet,
aft that they had slain athaliah with the sword.

24:1 joash wa seven year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
forti year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also wa zibiah of
beersheba.

24:2 and joash did that which wa right in the sight of the lord all
th day of jehoiada the priest.

24:3 and jehoiada took for him two wives; and he begat son and
daughters.

24:4 and it came to pass after this, that joash wa mind to repair
th hous of the lord.

24:5 and he gather togeth the priest and the levites, and said to
them, Go out unto the citi of judah, and gather of all israel money
to repair the hous of your god from year to year, and see that ye
hasten the matter. howbeit the levit hasten it not.

24:6 and the king call for jehoiada the chief, and said unto him,
whi hast thou not requir of the levit to bring in out of judah and
out of jerusalem the collection, accord to the command of moses
th servant of the lord, and of the congreg of israel, for the
tabernacl of witness?  24:7 for the son of athaliah, that wicked
woman, had broken up the hous of god; and also all the dedicated
th of the hous of the lord did they bestow upon baalim.

24:8 and at the king' command they made a chest, and set it
without at the gate of the hous of the lord.

24:9 and they made a proclam through judah and jerusalem, to
br in to the lord the collect that mose the servant of god laid
upon israel in the wilderness.

24:10 and all the princ and all the peopl rejoiced, and brought in,
and cast into the chest, until they had made an end.

24:11 now it came to pass, that at what time the chest wa brought
unto the king' offic by the hand of the levites, and when they saw
that there wa much money, the king' scribe and the high priest's
offic came and empti the chest, and took it, and carri it to his
plac again. thu they did day by day, and gather money in
abundance.

24:12 and the king and jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the
servic of the hous of the lord, and hire mason and carpent to
repair the hous of the lord, and also such as wrought iron and brass
to mend the hous of the lord.

24:13 So the workmen wrought, and the work wa perfect by them, and
they set the hous of god in hi state, and strengthen it.

24:14 and when they had finish it, they brought the rest of the
money befor the king and jehoiada, whereof were made vessel for the
hous of the lord, even vessel to minister, and to offer withal, and
spoons, and vessel of gold and silver. and they offer burnt
off in the hous of the lord continu all the day of
jehoiada.

24:15 but jehoiada wax old, and wa full of day when he died; an
hundr and thirti year old wa he when he died.

24:16 and they buri him in the citi of david among the kings,
becaus he had done good in israel, both toward god, and toward his
house.

24:17 now after the death of jehoiada came the princ of judah, and
mad obeis to the king. then the king hearken unto them.

24:18 and they left the hous of the lord god of their fathers, and
serv grove and idols: and wrath came upon judah and jerusalem for
thi their trespass.

24:19 yet he sent prophet to them, to bring them again unto the lord;
and they testifi against them: but they would not give ear.

24:20 and the spirit of god came upon zechariah the son of jehoiada
th priest, which stood abov the people, and said unto them, thus
saith god, whi transgress ye the command of the lord, that ye
cannot prosper? becaus ye have forsaken the lord, he hath also
forsaken you.

24:21 and they conspir against him, and stone him with stone at
th command of the king in the court of the hous of the lord.

24:22 thu joash the king rememb not the kind which jehoiada
hi father had done to him, but slew hi son. and when he died, he
said, the lord look upon it, and requir it.

24:23 and it came to pass at the end of the year, that the host of
syria came up against him: and they came to judah and jerusalem, and
destroy all the princ of the peopl from among the people, and
sent all the spoil of them unto the king of damascus.

24:24 for the armi of the syrian came with a small compani of men,
and the lord deliv a veri great host into their hand, becaus they
had forsaken the lord god of their fathers. So they execut judgment
against joash.

24:25 and when they were depart from him, (for they left him in
great diseases,) hi own servant conspir against him for the blood
of the son of jehoiada the priest, and slew him on hi bed, and he
died: and they buri him in the citi of david, but they buri him
not in the sepulchr of the kings.

24:26 and these are they that conspir against him; zabad the son of
shimeath an ammonitess, and jehozabad the son of shimrith a moabitess.

24:27 now concern hi sons, and the great of the burden laid
upon him, and the repair of the hous of god, behold, they are
written in the stori of the book of the kings. and amaziah hi son
reign in hi stead.

25:1 amaziah wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign, and
h reign twenti and nine year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name
wa jehoaddan of jerusalem.

25:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord, but not
with a perfect heart.

25:3 now it came to pass, when the kingdom wa establish to him,
that he slew hi servant that had kill the king hi father.

25:4 but he slew not their children, but did as it is written in the
law in the book of moses, where the lord commanded, saying, the
fath shall not die for the children, neither shall the children die
for the fathers, but everi man shall die for hi own sin.

25:5 moreov amaziah gather judah together, and made them captains
ov thousands, and captain over hundreds, accord to the hous of
their fathers, throughout all judah and benjamin: and he number them
from twenti year old and above, and found them three hundr thousand
choic men, abl to go forth to war, that could handl spear and
shield.

25:6 He hire also an hundr thousand mighti men of valour out of
israel for an hundr talent of silver.

25:7 but there came a man of god to him, saying, O king, let not the
armi of israel go with thee; for the lord is not with israel, to wit,
with all the children of ephraim.

25:8 but if thou wilt go, do it; be strong for the battle: god shall
mak thee fall befor the enemy: for god hath power to help, and to
cast down.

25:9 and amaziah said to the man of god, but what shall we do for the
hundr talent which I have given to the armi of israel? and the man
of god answered, the lord is abl to give thee much more than this.

25:10 then amaziah separ them, to wit, the armi that wa come to
him out of ephraim, to go home again: wherefor their anger was
greatli kindl against judah, and they return home in great anger.

25:11 and amaziah strengthen himself, and led forth hi people, and
went to the valley of salt, and smote of the children of seir ten
thousand.

25:12 and other ten thousand left aliv did the children of judah
carri away captive, and brought them unto the top of the rock, and
cast them down from the top of the rock, that they all were broken in
pieces.

25:13 but the soldier of the armi which amaziah sent back, that they
should not go with him to battle, fell upon the citi of judah, from
samaria even unto bethhoron, and smote three thousand of them, and
took much spoil.

25:14 now it came to pass, after that amaziah wa come from the
slaught of the edomites, that he brought the god of the children of
seir, and set them up to be hi gods, and bow down himself before
them, and burn incens unto them.

25:15 wherefor the anger of the lord wa kindl against amaziah, and
h sent unto him a prophet, which said unto him, whi hast thou sought
aft the god of the people, which could not deliv their own people
out of thine hand?  25:16 and it came to pass, as he talk with him,
that the king said unto him, art thou made of the king' counsel?
forbear; whi shouldest thou be smitten? then the prophet forbare, and
said, I know that god hath determin to destroy thee, becaus thou
hast done this, and hast not hearken unto my counsel.

25:17 then amaziah king of judah took advice, and sent to joash, the
son of jehoahaz, the son of jehu, king of israel, saying, come, let us
se one anoth in the face.

25:18 and joash king of israel sent to amaziah king of judah, saying,
th thistl that wa in lebanon sent to the cedar that wa in lebanon,
saying, give thi daughter to my son to wife: and there pass by a
wild beast that wa in lebanon, and trode down the thistle.

25:19 thou sayest, lo, thou hast smitten the edomites; and thine heart
lifteth thee up to boast: abid now at home; whi shouldest thou meddle
to thine hurt, that thou shouldest fall, even thou, and judah with
thee?  25:20 but amaziah would not hear; for it came of god, that he
might deliv them into the hand of their enemies, becaus they sought
aft the god of edom.

25:21 So joash the king of israel went up; and they saw one anoth in
th face, both he and amaziah king of judah, at bethshemesh, which
belongeth to judah.

25:22 and judah wa put to the wors befor israel, and they fled
everi man to hi tent.

25:23 and joash the king of israel took amaziah king of judah, the son
of joash, the son of jehoahaz, at bethshemesh, and brought him to
jerusalem, and brake down the wall of jerusalem from the gate of
ephraim to the corner gate, four hundr cubits.

25:24 and he took all the gold and the silver, and all the vessels
that were found in the hous of god with obededom, and the treasures
of the king' house, the hostag also, and return to samaria.

25:25 and amaziah the son of joash king of judah live after the death
of joash son of jehoahaz king of israel fifteen years.

25:26 now the rest of the act of amaziah, first and last, behold, are
they not written in the book of the king of judah and israel?  25:27
now after the time that amaziah did turn away from follow the lord
they made a conspiraci against him in jerusalem; and he fled to
lachish: but they sent to lachish after him, and slew him there.

25:28 and they brought him upon horses, and buri him with his
fath in the citi of judah.

26:1 then all the peopl of judah took uzziah, who wa sixteen years
old, and made him king in the room of hi father amaziah.

26:2 He built eloth, and restor it to judah, after that the king
slept with hi fathers.

26:3 sixteen year old wa uzziah when he began to reign, and he
reign fifti and two year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also was
jecoliah of jerusalem.

26:4 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father amaziah did.

26:5 and he sought god in the day of zechariah, who had understanding
in the vision of god: and as long as he sought the lord, god made him
to prosper.

26:6 and he went forth and war against the philistines, and brake
down the wall of gath, and the wall of jabneh, and the wall of ashdod,
and built citi about ashdod, and among the philistines.

26:7 and god help him against the philistines, and against the
arabian that dwelt in gurbaal, and the mehunims.

26:8 and the ammonit gave gift to uzziah: and hi name spread
abroad even to the enter in of egypt; for he strengthen himself
exceedingly.

26:9 moreov uzziah built tower in jerusalem at the corner gate, and
at the valley gate, and at the turn of the wall, and fortified
them.

26:10 also he built tower in the desert, and dig mani wells: for
h had much cattle, both in the low country, and in the plains:
husbandmen also, and vine dresser in the mountains, and in carmel:
for he love husbandry.

26:11 moreov uzziah had an host of fight men, that went out to
war by bands, accord to the number of their account by the hand of
jeiel the scribe and maaseiah the ruler, under the hand of hananiah,
on of the king' captains.

26:12 the whole number of the chief of the father of the mighti men
of valour were two thousand and six hundred.

26:13 and under their hand wa an army, three hundr thousand and
seven thousand and five hundred, that made war with mighti power, to
help the king against the enemy.

26:14 and uzziah prepar for them throughout all the host shields,
and spears, and helmets, and habergeons, and bows, and sling to cast
stones.

26:15 and he made in jerusalem engines, invent by cun men, to be
on the tower and upon the bulwarks, to shoot arrow and great stones
withal.

and hi name spread far abroad; for he wa marvel helped, till
h wa strong.

26:16 but when he wa strong, hi heart wa lift up to his
destruction: for he transgress against the lord hi god, and went
into the templ of the lord to burn incens upon the altar of incense.

26:17 and azariah the priest went in after him, and with him fourscore
priest of the lord, that were valiant men: 26:18 and they withstood
uzziah the king, and said unto him, It appertaineth not unto thee,
uzziah, to burn incens unto the lord, but to the priest the son of
aaron, that are consecr to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary;
for thou hast trespassed; neither shall it be for thine honour from
th lord god.

26:19 then uzziah wa wroth, and had a censer in hi hand to burn
incense: and while he wa wroth with the priests, the leprosi even
ros up in hi forehead befor the priest in the hous of the lord,
from besid the incens altar.

26:20 and azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, look upon
him, and, behold, he wa leprou in hi forehead, and they thrust him
out from thence; yea, himself hast also to go out, becaus the lord
had smitten him.

26:21 and uzziah the king wa a leper unto the day of hi death, and
dwelt in a sever house, be a leper; for he wa cut off from the
hous of the lord: and jotham hi son wa over the king' house,
judg the peopl of the land.

26:22 now the rest of the act of uzziah, first and last, did isaiah
th prophet, the son of amoz, write.

26:23 So uzziah slept with hi fathers, and they buri him with his
fath in the field of the burial which belong to the kings; for
they said, He is a leper: and jotham hi son reign in hi stead.

27:1 jotham wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign, and
h reign sixteen year in jerusalem. hi mother' name also was
jerushah, the daughter of zadok.

27:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that hi father uzziah did: howbeit he enter not
into the templ of the lord. and the peopl did yet corruptly.

27:3 He built the high gate of the hous of the lord, and on the wall
of ophel he built much.

27:4 moreov he built citi in the mountain of judah, and in the
forest he built castl and towers.

27:5 He fought also with the king of the ammonites, and prevailed
against them. and the children of ammon gave him the same year an
hundr talent of silver, and ten thousand measur of wheat, and ten
thousand of barley. So much did the children of ammon pay unto him,
both the second year, and the third.

27:6 So jotham becam mighty, becaus he prepar hi way befor the
lord hi god.

27:7 now the rest of the act of jotham, and all hi wars, and his
ways, lo, they are written in the book of the king of israel and
judah.

27:8 He wa five and twenti year old when he began to reign, and
reign sixteen year in jerusalem.

27:9 and jotham slept with hi fathers, and they buri him in the
citi of david: and ahaz hi son reign in hi stead.

28:1 ahaz wa twenti year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
sixteen year in jerusalem: but he did not that which wa right in the
sight of the lord, like david hi father: 28:2 for he walk in the
way of the king of israel, and made also molten imag for baalim.

28:3 moreov he burnt incens in the valley of the son of hinnom, and
burnt hi children in the fire, after the abomin of the heathen
whom the lord had cast out befor the children of israel.

28:4 He sacrif also and burnt incens in the high places, and on
th hills, and under everi green tree.

28:5 wherefor the lord hi god deliv him into the hand of the
k of syria; and they smote him, and carri away a great multitude
of them captives, and brought them to damascus. and he wa also
deliv into the hand of the king of israel, who smote him with a
great slaughter.

28:6 for pekah the son of remaliah slew in judah an hundr and twenty
thousand in one day, which were all valiant men; becaus they had
forsaken the lord god of their fathers.

28:7 and zichri, a mighti man of ephraim, slew maaseiah the king's
son, and azrikam the governor of the house, and elkanah that wa next
to the king.

28:8 and the children of israel carri away captiv of their brethren
two hundr thousand, women, sons, and daughters, and took also away
much spoil from them, and brought the spoil to samaria.

28:9 but a prophet of the lord wa there, whose name wa oded: and he
went out befor the host that came to samaria, and said unto them,
behold, becaus the lord god of your father wa wroth with judah, he
hath deliv them into your hand, and ye have slain them in a rage
that reacheth up unto heaven.

28:10 and now ye purpos to keep under the children of judah and
jerusalem for bondmen and bondwomen unto you: but are there not with
you, even with you, sin against the lord your god?  28:11 now hear me
therefore, and deliv the captiv again, which ye have taken captive
of your brethren: for the fierc wrath of the lord is upon you.

28:12 then certain of the head of the children of ephraim, azariah
th son of johanan, berechiah the son of meshillemoth, and jehizkiah
th son of shallum, and amasa the son of hadlai, stood up against them
that came from the war, 28:13 and said unto them, Ye shall not bring
in the captiv hither: for wherea we have offend against the lord
already, ye intend to add more to our sin and to our trespass: for
our trespass is great, and there is fierc wrath against israel.

28:14 So the arm men left the captiv and the spoil befor the
princ and all the congregation.

28:15 and the men which were express by name rose up, and took the
captives, and with the spoil cloth all that were nake among them,
and array them, and shod them, and gave them to eat and to drink,
and anoint them, and carri all the feebl of them upon asses, and
brought them to jericho, the citi of palm trees, to their brethren:
then they return to samaria.

28:16 At that time did king ahaz send unto the king of assyria to
help him.

28:17 for again the edomit had come and smitten judah, and carried
away captives.

28:18 the philistin also had invad the citi of the low country,
and of the south of judah, and had taken bethshemesh, and ajalon, and
gederoth, and shocho with the villag thereof, and timnah with the
villag thereof, gimzo also and the villag thereof: and they dwelt
there.

28:19 for the lord brought judah low becaus of ahaz king of israel;
for he made judah naked, and transgress sore against the lord.

28:20 and tilgathpilnes king of assyria came unto him, and
distress him, but strengthen him not.

28:21 for ahaz took away a portion out of the hous of the lord, and
out of the hous of the king, and of the princes, and gave it unto the
k of assyria: but he help him not.

28:22 and in the time of hi distress did he trespass yet more against
th lord: thi is that king ahaz.

28:23 for he sacrif unto the god of damascus, which smote him:
and he said, becaus the god of the king of syria help them,
therefor will I sacrific to them, that they may help me. but they
wer the ruin of him, and of all israel.

28:24 and ahaz gather togeth the vessel of the hous of god, and
cut in piec the vessel of the hous of god, and shut up the doors
of the hous of the lord, and he made him altar in everi corner of
jerusalem.

28:25 and in everi sever citi of judah he made high place to burn
incens unto other gods, and provok to anger the lord god of his
fathers.

28:26 now the rest of hi act and of all hi ways, first and last,
behold, they are written in the book of the king of judah and israel.

28:27 and ahaz slept with hi fathers, and they buri him in the
city, even in jerusalem: but they brought him not into the sepulchres
of the king of israel: and hezekiah hi son reign in hi stead.

29:1 hezekiah began to reign when he wa five and twenti year old,
and he reign nine and twenti year in jerusalem. and hi mother's
nam wa abijah, the daughter of zechariah.

29:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord,
accord to all that david hi father had done.

29:3 He in the first year of hi reign, in the first month, open the
door of the hous of the lord, and repair them.

29:4 and he brought in the priest and the levites, and gather them
togeth into the east street, 29:5 and said unto them, hear me, ye
levites, sanctifi now yourselves, and sanctifi the hous of the lord
god of your fathers, and carri forth the filthi out of the holy
place.

29:6 for our father have trespassed, and done that which wa evil in
th eye of the lord our god, and have forsaken him, and have turned
away their face from the habit of the lord, and turn their
backs.

29:7 also they have shut up the door of the porch, and put out the
lamps, and have not burn incens nor offer burnt offer in the
holi place unto the god of israel.

29:8 wherefor the wrath of the lord wa upon judah and jerusalem, and
h hath deliv them to trouble, to astonishment, and to hissing, as
y see with your eyes.

29:9 for, lo, our father have fallen by the sword, and our son and
our daughter and our wive are in captiv for this.

29:10 now it is in mine heart to make a coven with the lord god of
israel, that hi fierc wrath may turn away from us.

29:11 My sons, be not now negligent: for the lord hath chosen you to
stand befor him, to serv him, and that ye should minist unto him,
and burn incense.

29:12 then the levit arose, mahath the son of amasai, and joel the
son of azariah, of the son of the kohathites: and of the son of
merari, kish the son of abdi, and azariah the son of jehalelel: and of
th gershonites; joah the son of zimmah, and eden the son of joah:
29:13 and of the son of elizaphan; shimri, and jeiel: and of the sons
of asaph; zechariah, and mattaniah: 29:14 and of the son of heman;
jehiel, and shimei: and of the son of jeduthun; shemaiah, and uzziel.

29:15 and they gather their brethren, and sanctifi themselves, and
came, accord to the command of the king, by the word of the
lord, to cleans the hous of the lord.

29:16 and the priest went into the inner part of the hous of the
lord, to cleans it, and brought out all the unclean that they
found in the templ of the lord into the court of the hous of the
lord. and the levit took it, to carri it out abroad into the brook
kidron.

29:17 now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify,
and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of the lord:
so they sanctifi the hous of the lord in eight days; and in the
sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.

29:18 then they went in to hezekiah the king, and said, We have
cleans all the hous of the lord, and the altar of burnt offering,
with all the vessel thereof, and the shewbread table, with all the
vessel thereof.

29:19 moreov all the vessels, which king ahaz in hi reign did cast
away in hi transgression, have we prepar and sanctified, and,
behold, they are befor the altar of the lord.

29:20 then hezekiah the king rose early, and gather the ruler of
th city, and went up to the hous of the lord.

29:21 and they brought seven bullocks, and seven rams, and seven
lambs, and seven he goats, for a sin offer for the kingdom, and for
th sanctuary, and for judah. and he command the priest the son of
aaron to offer them on the altar of the lord.

29:22 So they kill the bullocks, and the priest receiv the blood,
and sprinkl it on the altar: likewise, when they had kill the
rams, they sprinkl the blood upon the altar: they kill also the
lambs, and they sprinkl the blood upon the altar.

29:23 and they brought forth the he goat for the sin offer before
th king and the congregation; and they laid their hand upon them:
29:24 and the priest kill them, and they made reconcili with
their blood upon the altar, to make an aton for all israel: for
th king command that the burnt offer and the sin offer should
b made for all israel.

29:25 and he set the levit in the hous of the lord with cymbals,
with psalteries, and with harps, accord to the command of
david, and of gad the king' seer, and nathan the prophet: for so was
th command of the lord by hi prophets.

29:26 and the levit stood with the instrument of david, and the
priest with the trumpets.

29:27 and hezekiah command to offer the burnt offer upon the
altar.

and when the burnt offer began, the song of the lord began also
with the trumpets, and with the instrument ordain by david king of
israel.

29:28 and all the congreg worshipped, and the singer sang, and
th trumpet sounded: and all thi continu until the burnt
off wa finished.

29:29 and when they had made an end of offering, the king and all that
wer present with him bow themselves, and worshipped.

29:30 moreov hezekiah the king and the princ command the levites
to sing prais unto the lord with the word of david, and of asaph the
seer. and they sang prais with gladness, and they bow their heads
and worshipped.

29:31 then hezekiah answer and said, now ye have consecrated
yourselv unto the lord, come near and bring sacrific and thank
off into the hous of the lord. and the congreg brought in
sacrific and thank offerings; and as mani as were of a free heart
burnt offerings.

29:32 and the number of the burnt offerings, which the congregation
brought, wa threescor and ten bullocks, an hundr rams, and two
hundr lambs: all these were for a burnt offer to the lord.

29:33 and the consecr thing were six hundr oxen and three
thousand sheep.

29:34 but the priest were too few, so that they could not flay all
th burnt offerings: wherefor their brethren the levit did help
them, till the work wa ended, and until the other priest had
sanctifi themselves: for the levit were more upright in heart to
sanctifi themselv than the priests.

29:35 and also the burnt offer were in abundance, with the fat of
th peac offerings, and the drink offer for everi burnt offering.
so the servic of the hous of the lord wa set in order.

29:36 and hezekiah rejoiced, and all the people, that god had prepared
th people: for the thing wa done suddenly.

30:1 and hezekiah sent to all israel and judah, and wrote letter also
to ephraim and manasseh, that they should come to the hous of the
lord at jerusalem, to keep the passov unto the lord god of israel.

30:2 for the king had taken counsel, and hi princes, and all the
congreg in jerusalem, to keep the passov in the second month.

30:3 for they could not keep it at that time, becaus the priest had
not sanctifi themselv sufficiently, neither had the people
gath themselv togeth to jerusalem.

30:4 and the thing pleas the king and all the congregation.

30:5 So they establish a decre to make proclam throughout all
israel, from beersheba even to dan, that they should come to keep the
passov unto the lord god of israel at jerusalem: for they had not
don it of a long time in such sort as it wa written.

30:6 So the post went with the letter from the king and hi princes
throughout all israel and judah, and accord to the command of
th king, saying, Ye children of israel, turn again unto the lord god
of abraham, isaac, and israel, and he will return to the remnant of
you, that are escap out of the hand of the king of assyria.

30:7 and be not ye like your fathers, and like your brethren, which
trespass against the lord god of their fathers, who therefor gave
them up to desolation, as ye see.

30:8 now be ye not stiffnecked, as your father were, but yield
yourselv unto the lord, and enter into hi sanctuary, which he hath
sanctifi for ever: and serv the lord your god, that the fierceness
of hi wrath may turn away from you.

30:9 for if ye turn again unto the lord, your brethren and your
children shall find compass befor them that lead them captive, so
that they shall come again into thi land: for the lord your god is
graci and merciful, and will not turn away hi face from you, if ye
return unto him.

30:10 So the post pass from citi to citi through the countri of
ephraim and manasseh even unto zebulun: but they laugh them to
scorn, and mock them.

30:11 nevertheless diver of asher and manasseh and of zebulun humbled
themselves, and came to jerusalem.

30:12 also in judah the hand of god wa to give them one heart to do
th command of the king and of the princes, by the word of the
lord.

30:13 and there assembl at jerusalem much peopl to keep the feast
of unleaven bread in the second month, a veri great congregation.

30:14 and they aros and took away the altar that were in jerusalem,
and all the altar for incens took they away, and cast them into the
brook kidron.

30:15 then they kill the passov on the fourteenth day of the
second month: and the priest and the levit were ashamed, and
sanctifi themselves, and brought in the burnt offer into the
hous of the lord.

30:16 and they stood in their place after their manner, accord to
th law of mose the man of god: the priest sprinkl the blood,
which they receiv of the hand of the levites.

30:17 for there were mani in the congreg that were not
sanctified: therefor the levit had the charg of the kill of the
passov for everi one that wa not clean, to sanctifi them unto the
lord.

30:18 for a multitud of the people, even mani of ephraim, and
manasseh, issachar, and zebulun, had not cleans themselves, yet did
they eat the passov otherwis than it wa written. but hezekiah
pray for them, saying, the good lord pardon everi one 30:19 that
prepareth hi heart to seek god, the lord god of hi fathers, though
h be not cleans accord to the purif of the sanctuary.

30:20 and the lord hearken to hezekiah, and heal the people.

30:21 and the children of israel that were present at jerusalem kept
th feast of unleaven bread seven day with great gladness: and the
levit and the priest prais the lord day by day, sing with loud
instru unto the lord.

30:22 and hezekiah spake comfort unto all the levit that taught
th good knowledg of the lord: and they did eat throughout the feast
seven days, offer peac offerings, and make confess to the
lord god of their fathers.

30:23 and the whole assembl took counsel to keep other seven days:
and they kept other seven day with gladness.

30:24 for hezekiah king of judah did give to the congreg a
thousand bullock and seven thousand sheep; and the princ gave to
th congreg a thousand bullock and ten thousand sheep: and a
great number of priest sanctifi themselves.

30:25 and all the congreg of judah, with the priest and the
levites, and all the congreg that came out of israel, and the
strang that came out of the land of israel, and that dwelt in
judah, rejoiced.

30:26 So there wa great joy in jerusalem: for sinc the time of
solomon the son of david king of israel there wa not the like in
jerusalem.

30:27 then the priest the levit aros and bless the people: and
their voic wa heard, and their prayer came up to hi holi dwelling
place, even unto heaven.

31:1 now when all thi wa finished, all israel that were present went
out to the citi of judah, and brake the imag in pieces, and cut
down the groves, and threw down the high place and the altar out of
al judah and benjamin, in ephraim also and manasseh, until they had
utterli destroy them all. then all the children of israel returned,
everi man to hi possession, into their own cities.

31:2 and hezekiah appoint the cours of the priest and the levites
aft their courses, everi man accord to hi service, the priests
and levit for burnt offer and for peac offerings, to minister,
and to give thanks, and to prais in the gate of the tent of the
lord.

31:3 He appoint also the king' portion of hi substanc for the
burnt offerings, to wit, for the morn and even burnt offerings,
and the burnt offer for the sabbaths, and for the new moons, and
for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of the lord.

31:4 moreov he command the peopl that dwelt in jerusalem to give
th portion of the priest and the levites, that they might be
encourag in the law of the lord.

31:5 and as soon as the command came abroad, the children of
israel brought in abund the firstfruit of corn, wine, and oil,
and honey, and of all the increas of the field; and the tith of all
th brought they in abundantly.

31:6 and concern the children of israel and judah, that dwelt in
th citi of judah, they also brought in the tith of oxen and sheep,
and the tith of holi thing which were consecr unto the lord
their god, and laid them by heaps.

31:7 In the third month they began to lay the foundat of the heaps,
and finish them in the seventh month.

31:8 and when hezekiah and the princ came and saw the heaps, they
bless the lord, and hi peopl israel.

31:9 then hezekiah question with the priest and the levites
concern the heaps.

31:10 and azariah the chief priest of the hous of zadok answer him,
and said, sinc the peopl began to bring the offer into the house
of the lord, we have had enough to eat, and have left plenty: for the
lord hath bless hi people; and that which is left is thi great
store.

31:11 then hezekiah command to prepar chamber in the hous of the
lord; and they prepar them, 31:12 and brought in the offer and
th tith and the dedic thing faithfully: over which cononiah
th levit wa ruler, and shimei hi brother wa the next.

31:13 and jehiel, and azaziah, and nahath, and asahel, and jerimoth,
and jozabad, and eliel, and ismachiah, and mahath, and benaiah, were
overs under the hand of cononiah and shimei hi brother, at the
command of hezekiah the king, and azariah the ruler of the house
of god.

31:14 and kore the son of imnah the levite, the porter toward the
east, wa over the freewil offer of god, to distribut the
obl of the lord, and the most holi things.

31:15 and next him were eden, and miniamin, and jeshua, and shemaiah,
amariah, and shecaniah, in the citi of the priests, in their set
office, to give to their brethren by courses, as well to the great as
to the small: 31:16 besid their genealog of males, from three years
old and upward, even unto everi one that entereth into the hous of
th lord, hi daili portion for their servic in their charges
accord to their courses; 31:17 both to the genealog of the priests
bi the hous of their fathers, and the levit from twenti year old
and upward, in their charg by their courses; 31:18 and to the
genealog of all their littl ones, their wives, and their sons, and
their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their set office
they sanctifi themselv in holiness: 31:19 also of the son of
aaron the priests, which were in the field of the suburb of their
cities, in everi sever city, the men that were express by name, to
giv portion to all the male among the priests, and to all that were
reckon by genealog among the levites.

31:20 and thu did hezekiah throughout all judah, and wrought that
which wa good and right and truth befor the lord hi god.

31:21 and in everi work that he began in the servic of the hous of
god, and in the law, and in the commandments, to seek hi god, he did
it with all hi heart, and prospered.

32:1 after these things, and the establish thereof, sennacherib
k of assyria came, and enter into judah, and encamp against the
fenc cities, and thought to win them for himself.

32:2 and when hezekiah saw that sennacherib wa come, and that he was
purpos to fight against jerusalem, 32:3 He took counsel with his
princ and hi mighti men to stop the water of the fountain which
wer without the city: and they did help him.

32:4 So there wa gather much peopl together, who stop all the
fountains, and the brook that ran through the midst of the land,
saying, whi should the king of assyria come, and find much water?
32:5 also he strengthen himself, and built up all the wall that was
broken, and rais it up to the towers, and anoth wall without, and
repair millo in the citi of david, and made dart and shield in
abundance.

32:6 and he set captain of war over the people, and gather them
togeth to him in the street of the gate of the city, and spake
comfort to them, saying, 32:7 Be strong and courageous, be not
afraid nor dismay for the king of assyria, nor for all the multitude
that is with him: for there be more with us than with him: 32:8 with
him is an arm of flesh; but with us is the lord our god to help us,
and to fight our battles. and the peopl rest themselv upon the
word of hezekiah king of judah.

32:9 after thi did sennacherib king of assyria send hi servant to
jerusalem, (but he himself laid sieg against lachish, and all his
pow with him,) unto hezekiah king of judah, and unto all judah that
wer at jerusalem, saying, 32:10 thu saith sennacherib king of
assyria, whereon do ye trust, that ye abid in the sieg in jerusalem?
32:11 doth not hezekiah persuad you to give over yourselv to die by
famin and by thirst, saying, the lord our god shall deliv us out of
th hand of the king of assyria?  32:12 hath not the same hezekiah
taken away hi high place and hi altars, and command judah and
jerusalem, saying, Ye shall worship befor one altar, and burn incense
upon it?  32:13 know ye not what I and my father have done unto all
th peopl of other lands? were the god of the nation of those lands
ani way abl to deliv their land out of mine hand?  32:14 who was
ther among all the god of those nation that my father utterly
destroyed, that could deliv hi peopl out of mine hand, that your
god should be abl to deliv you out of mine hand?  32:15 now
therefor let not hezekiah deceiv you, nor persuad you on this
manner, neither yet believ him: for no god of ani nation or kingdom
wa abl to deliv hi peopl out of mine hand, and out of the hand
of my fathers: how much less shall your god deliv you out of mine
hand?  32:16 and hi servant spake yet more against the lord god, and
against hi servant hezekiah.

32:17 He wrote also letter to rail on the lord god of israel, and to
speak against him, saying, As the god of the nation of other lands
hav not deliv their peopl out of mine hand, so shall not the god
of hezekiah deliv hi peopl out of mine hand.

32:18 then they cri with a loud voic in the jews' speech unto the
peopl of jerusalem that were on the wall, to affright them, and to
troubl them; that they might take the city.

32:19 and they spake against the god of jerusalem, as against the gods
of the peopl of the earth, which were the work of the hand of man.

32:20 and for thi caus hezekiah the king, and the prophet isaiah the
son of amoz, pray and cri to heaven.

32:21 and the lord sent an angel, which cut off all the mighti men of
valour, and the leader and captain in the camp of the king of
assyria. So he return with shame of face to hi own land. and when
h wa come into the hous of hi god, they that came forth of hi own
bowel slew him there with the sword.

32:22 thu the lord save hezekiah and the inhabit of jerusalem
from the hand of sennacherib the king of assyria, and from the hand of
al other, and guid them on everi side.

32:23 and mani brought gift unto the lord to jerusalem, and presents
to hezekiah king of judah: so that he wa magnifi in the sight of
al nation from thenceforth.

32:24 In those day hezekiah wa sick to the death, and pray unto
th lord: and he spake unto him, and he gave him a sign.

32:25 but hezekiah render not again accord to the benefit done
unto him; for hi heart wa lift up: therefor there wa wrath upon
him, and upon judah and jerusalem.

32:26 notwithstand hezekiah humbl himself for the pride of his
heart, both he and the inhabit of jerusalem, so that the wrath of
th lord came not upon them in the day of hezekiah.

32:27 and hezekiah had exceed much rich and honour: and he made
himself treasuri for silver, and for gold, and for preciou stones,
and for spices, and for shields, and for all manner of pleasant
jewels; 32:28 storehous also for the increas of corn, and wine, and
oil; and stall for all manner of beasts, and cote for flocks.

32:29 moreov he provid him cities, and possess of flock and
herd in abundance: for god had given him substanc veri much.

32:30 thi same hezekiah also stop the upper watercours of gihon,
and brought it straight down to the west side of the citi of david.
and hezekiah prosper in all hi works.

32:31 howbeit in the busi of the ambassador of the princ of
babylon, who sent unto him to enquir of the wonder that wa done in
th land, god left him, to tri him, that he might know all that wa in
hi heart.

32:32 now the rest of the act of hezekiah, and hi goodness, behold,
they are written in the vision of isaiah the prophet, the son of amoz,
and in the book of the king of judah and israel.

32:33 and hezekiah slept with hi fathers, and they buri him in the
chiefest of the sepulchr of the son of david: and all judah and the
inhabit of jerusalem did him honour at hi death. and manasseh his
son reign in hi stead.

33:1 manasseh wa twelv year old when he began to reign, and he
reign fifti and five year in jerusalem: 33:2 but did that which was
evil in the sight of the lord, like unto the abomin of the
heathen, whom the lord had cast out befor the children of israel.

33:3 for he built again the high place which hezekiah hi father had
broken down, and he rear up altar for baalim, and made groves, and
worship all the host of heaven, and serv them.

33:4 also he built altar in the hous of the lord, whereof the lord
had said, In jerusalem shall my name be for ever.

33:5 and he built altar for all the host of heaven in the two courts
of the hous of the lord.
