33:6 and he caus hi children to pass through the fire in the valley
of the son of hinnom: also he observ times, and use enchantments,
and use witchcraft, and dealt with a familiar spirit, and with
wizards: he wrought much evil in the sight of the lord, to provok him
to anger.

33:7 and he set a carv image, the idol which he had made, in the
hous of god, of which god had said to david and to solomon hi son,
in thi house, and in jerusalem, which I have chosen befor all the
trib of israel, will I put my name for ever: 33:8 neither will I any
mor remov the foot of israel from out of the land which I have
appoint for your fathers; so that they will take heed to do all that
i have command them, accord to the whole law and the statut and
th ordin by the hand of moses.

33:9 So manasseh made judah and the inhabit of jerusalem to err,
and to do wors than the heathen, whom the lord had destroy before
th children of israel.

33:10 and the lord spake to manasseh, and to hi people: but they
would not hearken.

33:11 wherefor the lord brought upon them the captain of the host of
th king of assyria, which took manasseh among the thorns, and bound
him with fetters, and carri him to babylon.

33:12 and when he wa in affliction, he besought the lord hi god, and
humbl himself greatli befor the god of hi fathers, 33:13 and
pray unto him: and he wa intreat of him, and heard his
supplication, and brought him again to jerusalem into hi kingdom.
then manasseh knew that the lord he wa god.

33:14 now after thi he built a wall without the citi of david, on the
west side of gihon, in the valley, even to the enter in at the fish
gate, and compass about ophel, and rais it up a veri great height,
and put captain of war in all the fenc citi of judah.

33:15 and he took away the strang gods, and the idol out of the house
of the lord, and all the altar that he had built in the mount of the
hous of the lord, and in jerusalem, and cast them out of the city.

33:16 and he repair the altar of the lord, and sacrif thereon
peac offer and thank offerings, and command judah to serv the
lord god of israel.

33:17 nevertheless the peopl did sacrific still in the high places,
yet unto the lord their god only.

33:18 now the rest of the act of manasseh, and hi prayer unto his
god, and the word of the seer that spake to him in the name of the
lord god of israel, behold, they are written in the book of the kings
of israel.

33:19 hi prayer also, and how god wa intreat of him, and all his
sins, and hi trespass, and the place wherein he built high places,
and set up grove and graven images, befor he wa humbled: behold,
they are written among the say of the seers.

33:20 So manasseh slept with hi fathers, and they buri him in his
own house: and amon hi son reign in hi stead.

33:21 amon wa two and twenti year old when he began to reign, and
reign two year in jerusalem.

33:22 but he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord, as did
manasseh hi father: for amon sacrif unto all the carv images
which manasseh hi father had made, and serv them; 33:23 and humbled
not himself befor the lord, as manasseh hi father had humbled
himself; but amon trespass more and more.

33:24 and hi servant conspir against him, and slew him in hi own
house.

33:25 but the peopl of the land slew all them that had conspired
against king amon; and the peopl of the land made josiah hi son king
in hi stead.

34:1 josiah wa eight year old when he began to reign, and he reigned
in jerusalem one and thirti years.

34:2 and he did that which wa right in the sight of the lord, and
walk in the way of david hi father, and declin neither to the
right hand, nor to the left.

34:3 for in the eighth year of hi reign, while he wa yet young, he
began to seek after the god of david hi father: and in the twelfth
year he began to purg judah and jerusalem from the high places, and
th groves, and the carv images, and the molten images.

34:4 and they brake down the altar of baalim in hi presence; and the
images, that were on high abov them, he cut down; and the groves, and
th carv images, and the molten images, he brake in pieces, and made
dust of them, and strow it upon the grave of them that had
sacrif unto them.

34:5 and he burnt the bone of the priest upon their altars, and
cleans judah and jerusalem.

34:6 and so did he in the citi of manasseh, and ephraim, and simeon,
even unto naphtali, with their mattock round about.

34:7 and when he had broken down the altar and the groves, and had
beaten the graven imag into powder, and cut down all the idols
throughout all the land of israel, he return to jerusalem.

34:8 now in the eighteenth year of hi reign, when he had purg the
land, and the house, he sent shaphan the son of azaliah, and maaseiah
th governor of the city, and joah the son of joahaz the recorder, to
repair the hous of the lord hi god.

34:9 and when they came to hilkiah the high priest, they deliv the
money that wa brought into the hous of god, which the levit that
kept the door had gather of the hand of manasseh and ephraim, and
of all the remnant of israel, and of all judah and benjamin; and they
return to jerusalem.

34:10 and they put it in the hand of the workmen that had the
oversight of the hous of the lord, and they gave it to the workmen
that wrought in the hous of the lord, to repair and amend the house:
34:11 even to the artific and builder gave they it, to buy hewn
stone, and timber for couplings, and to floor the hous which the
k of judah had destroyed.

34:12 and the men did the work faithfully: and the overs of them
wer jahath and obadiah, the levites, of the son of merari; and
zechariah and meshullam, of the son of the kohathites, to set it
forward; and other of the levites, all that could skill of instruments
of musick.

34:13 also they were over the bearer of burdens, and were overseers
of all that wrought the work in ani manner of service: and of the
levit there were scribes, and officers, and porters.

34:14 and when they brought out the money that wa brought into the
hous of the lord, hilkiah the priest found a book of the law of the
lord given by moses.

34:15 and hilkiah answer and said to shaphan the scribe, I have
found the book of the law in the hous of the lord. and hilkiah
deliv the book to shaphan.

34:16 and shaphan carri the book to the king, and brought the king
word back again, saying, all that wa commit to thi servants, they
do it.

34:17 and they have gather togeth the money that wa found in the
hous of the lord, and have deliv it into the hand of the
overseers, and to the hand of the workmen.

34:18 then shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, hilkiah the
priest hath given me a book. and shaphan read it befor the king.

34:19 and it came to pass, when the king had heard the word of the
law, that he rent hi clothes.

34:20 and the king command hilkiah, and ahikam the son of shaphan,
and abdon the son of micah, and shaphan the scribe, and asaiah a
serv of the king's, saying, 34:21 go, enquir of the lord for me,
and for them that are left in israel and in judah, concern the
word of the book that is found: for great is the wrath of the lord
that is pour out upon us, becaus our father have not kept the word
of the lord, to do after all that is written in thi book.

34:22 and hilkiah, and they that the king had appointed, went to
huldah the prophetess, the wife of shallum the son of tikvath, the son
of hasrah, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in jerusalem in the
college:) and they spake to her to that effect.

34:23 and she answer them, thu saith the lord god of israel, tell
y the man that sent you to me, 34:24 thu saith the lord, behold, i
wil bring evil upon thi place, and upon the inhabit thereof,
even all the curs that are written in the book which they have read
befor the king of judah: 34:25 becaus they have forsaken me, and
hav burn incens unto other gods, that they might provok me to
ang with all the work of their hands; therefor my wrath shall be
pour out upon thi place, and shall not be quenched.

34:26 and as for the king of judah, who sent you to enquir of the
lord, so shall ye say unto him, thu saith the lord god of israel
concern the word which thou hast heard; 34:27 becaus thine heart
wa tender, and thou didst humbl thyself befor god, when thou
heardest hi word against thi place, and against the inhabitants
thereof, and humbledst thyself befor me, and didst rend thi clothes,
and weep befor me; I have even heard thee also, saith the lord.

34:28 behold, I will gather thee to thi fathers, and thou shalt be
gath to thi grave in peace, neither shall thine eye see all the
evil that I will bring upon thi place, and upon the inhabit of
th same. So they brought the king word again.

34:29 then the king sent and gather togeth all the elder of judah
and jerusalem.

34:30 and the king went up into the hous of the lord, and all the men
of judah, and the inhabit of jerusalem, and the priests, and the
levites, and all the people, great and small: and he read in their
ear all the word of the book of the coven that wa found in the
hous of the lord.

34:31 and the king stood in hi place, and made a coven befor the
lord, to walk after the lord, and to keep hi commandments, and his
testimonies, and hi statutes, with all hi heart, and with all his
soul, to perform the word of the coven which are written in this
book.

34:32 and he caus all that were present in jerusalem and benjamin to
stand to it. and the inhabit of jerusalem did accord to the
coven of god, the god of their fathers.

34:33 and josiah took away all the abomin out of all the
countri that pertain to the children of israel, and made all that
wer present in israel to serve, even to serv the lord their god. and
al hi day they depart not from follow the lord, the god of
their fathers.

35:1 moreov josiah kept a passov unto the lord in jerusalem: and
they kill the passov on the fourteenth day of the first month.

35:2 and he set the priest in their charges, and encourag them to
th servic of the hous of the lord, 35:3 and said unto the levites
that taught all israel, which were holi unto the lord, put the holy
ark in the hous which solomon the son of david king of israel did
build; it shall not be a burden upon your shoulders: serv now the
lord your god, and hi peopl israel, 35:4 and prepar yourselv by
th hous of your fathers, after your courses, accord to the
writ of david king of israel, and accord to the write of
solomon hi son.

35:5 and stand in the holi place accord to the divis of the
famili of the father of your brethren the people, and after the
divis of the famili of the levites.

35:6 So kill the passover, and sanctifi yourselves, and prepar your
brethren, that they may do accord to the word of the lord by the
hand of moses.

35:7 and josiah gave to the people, of the flock, lamb and kids, all
for the passov offerings, for all that were present, to the number
of thirti thousand, and three thousand bullocks: these were of the
king' substance.

35:8 and hi princ gave willingli unto the people, to the priests,
and to the levites: hilkiah and zechariah and jehiel, ruler of the
hous of god, gave unto the priest for the passov offer two
thousand and six hundr small cattl and three hundr oxen.

35:9 conaniah also, and shemaiah and nethaneel, hi brethren, and
hashabiah and jeiel and jozabad, chief of the levites, gave unto the
levit for passov offer five thousand small cattle, and five
hundr oxen.

35:10 So the servic wa prepared, and the priest stood in their
place, and the levit in their courses, accord to the king's
commandment.

35:11 and they kill the passover, and the priest sprinkl the
blood from their hands, and the levit flay them.

35:12 and they remov the burnt offerings, that they might give
accord to the divis of the famili of the people, to offer
unto the lord, as it is written in the book of moses. and so did they
with the oxen.

35:13 and they roast the passov with fire accord to the
ordinance: but the other holi offer sod they in pots, and in
caldrons, and in pans, and divid them speedili among all the people.

35:14 and afterward they made readi for themselves, and for the
priests: becaus the priest the son of aaron were busi in offering
of burnt offer and the fat until night; therefor the levites
prepar for themselves, and for the priest the son of aaron.

35:15 and the singer the son of asaph were in their place, according
to the command of david, and asaph, and heman, and jeduthun the
king' seer; and the porter wait at everi gate; they might not
depart from their service; for their brethren the levit prepar for
them.

35:16 So all the servic of the lord wa prepar the same day, to
keep the passover, and to offer burnt offer upon the altar of the
lord, accord to the command of king josiah.

35:17 and the children of israel that were present kept the passover
at that time, and the feast of unleaven bread seven days.

35:18 and there wa no passov like to that kept in israel from the
day of samuel the prophet; neither did all the king of israel keep
such a passov as josiah kept, and the priests, and the levites, and
al judah and israel that were present, and the inhabit of
jerusalem.

35:19 In the eighteenth year of the reign of josiah wa thi passover
kept.

35:20 after all this, when josiah had prepar the temple, necho king
of egypt came up to fight against charchemish by euphrates: and josiah
w out against him.

35:21 but he sent ambassador to him, saying, what have I to do with
thee, thou king of judah? I come not against thee thi day, but
against the hous wherewith I have war: for god command me to make
haste: forbear thee from meddl with god, who is with me, that he
destroy thee not.

35:22 nevertheless josiah would not turn hi face from him, but
disguis himself, that he might fight with him, and hearken not
unto the word of necho from the mouth of god, and came to fight in
th valley of megiddo.

35:23 and the archer shot at king josiah; and the king said to his
servants, have me away; for I am sore wounded.

35:24 hi servant therefor took him out of that chariot, and put him
in the second chariot that he had; and they brought him to jerusalem,
and he died, and wa buri in one of the sepulchr of hi fathers.
and all judah and jerusalem mourn for josiah.

35:25 and jeremiah lament for josiah: and all the sing men and
th sing women spake of josiah in their lament to thi day,
and made them an ordin in israel: and, behold, they are written in
th lamentations.

35:26 now the rest of the act of josiah, and hi goodness, according
to that which wa written in the law of the lord, 35:27 and hi deeds,
first and last, behold, they are written in the book of the king of
israel and judah.

36:1 then the peopl of the land took jehoahaz the son of josiah, and
mad him king in hi father' stead in jerusalem.

36:2 jehoahaz wa twenti and three year old when he began to reign,
and he reign three month in jerusalem.

36:3 and the king of egypt put him down at jerusalem, and condemned
th land in an hundr talent of silver and a talent of gold.

36:4 and the king of egypt made eliakim hi brother king over judah
and jerusalem, and turn hi name to jehoiakim. and necho took
jehoahaz hi brother, and carri him to egypt.

36:5 jehoiakim wa twenti and five year old when he began to reign,
and he reign eleven year in jerusalem: and he did that which was
evil in the sight of the lord hi god.

36:6 against him came up nebuchadnezzar king of babylon, and bound him
in fetters, to carri him to babylon.

36:7 nebuchadnezzar also carri of the vessel of the hous of the
lord to babylon, and put them in hi templ at babylon.

36:8 now the rest of the act of jehoiakim, and hi abomin which
h did, and that which wa found in him, behold, they are written in
th book of the king of israel and judah: and jehoiachin hi son
reign in hi stead.

36:9 jehoiachin wa eight year old when he began to reign, and he
reign three month and ten day in jerusalem: and he did that which
wa evil in the sight of the lord.

36:10 and when the year wa expired, king nebuchadnezzar sent, and
brought him to babylon, with the goodli vessel of the hous of the
lord, and made zedekiah hi brother king over judah and jerusalem.

36:11 zedekiah wa one and twenti year old when he began to reign,
and reign eleven year in jerusalem.

36:12 and he did that which wa evil in the sight of the lord hi god,
and humbl not himself befor jeremiah the prophet speak from the
mouth of the lord.

36:13 and he also rebel against king nebuchadnezzar, who had made
him swear by god: but he stiffen hi neck, and harden hi heart
from turn unto the lord god of israel.

36:14 moreov all the chief of the priests, and the people,
transgress veri much after all the abomin of the heathen; and
pollut the hous of the lord which he had hallow in jerusalem.

36:15 and the lord god of their father sent to them by his
messengers, rise up betimes, and sending; becaus he had compassion
on hi people, and on hi dwell place: 36:16 but they mock the
messeng of god, and despis hi words, and misus hi prophets,
until the wrath of the lord aros against hi people, till there was
no remedy.

36:17 therefor he brought upon them the king of the chaldees, who
slew their young men with the sword in the hous of their sanctuary,
and had no compass upon young man or maiden, old man, or him that
stoop for age: he gave them all into hi hand.

36:18 and all the vessel of the hous of god, great and small, and
th treasur of the hous of the lord, and the treasur of the king,
and of hi princes; all these he brought to babylon.

36:19 and they burnt the hous of god, and brake down the wall of
jerusalem, and burnt all the palac thereof with fire, and destroyed
al the goodli vessel thereof.

36:20 and them that had escap from the sword carri he away to
babylon; where they were servant to him and hi son until the reign
of the kingdom of persia: 36:21 To fulfil the word of the lord by the
mouth of jeremiah, until the land had enjoy her sabbaths: for as
long as she lay desol she kept sabbath, to fulfil threescor and
ten years.

36:22 now in the first year of cyru king of persia, that the word of
th lord spoken by the mouth of jeremiah might be accomplished, the
lord stir up the spirit of cyru king of persia, that he made a
proclam throughout all hi kingdom, and put it also in writing,
saying, 36:23 thu saith cyru king of persia, all the kingdom of the
earth hath the lord god of heaven given me; and he hath charg me to
build him an hous in jerusalem, which is in judah. who is there among
y of all hi people?  the lord hi god be with him, and let him go up.




ezra


1:1 now in the first year of cyru king of persia, that the word of
th lord by the mouth of jeremiah might be fulfilled, the lord stirred
up the spirit of cyru king of persia, that he made a proclamation
throughout all hi kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying, 1:2
thu saith cyru king of persia, the lord god of heaven hath given me
al the kingdom of the earth; and he hath charg me to build him an
hous at jerusalem, which is in judah.

1:3 who is there among you of all hi people? hi god be with him, and
let him go up to jerusalem, which is in judah, and build the hous of
th lord god of israel, (he is the god,) which is in jerusalem.

1:4 and whosoev remaineth in ani place where he sojourneth, let the
men of hi place help him with silver, and with gold, and with goods,
and with beasts, besid the freewil offer for the hous of god
that is in jerusalem.

1:5 then rose up the chief of the father of judah and benjamin, and
th priests, and the levites, with all them whose spirit god had
raised, to go up to build the hous of the lord which is in jerusalem.

1:6 and all they that were about them strengthen their hand with
vessel of silver, with gold, with goods, and with beasts, and with
preci things, besid all that wa willingli offered.

1:7 also cyru the king brought forth the vessel of the hous of the
lord, which nebuchadnezzar had brought forth out of jerusalem, and had
put them in the hous of hi gods; 1:8 even those did cyru king of
persia bring forth by the hand of mithredath the treasurer, and
numb them unto sheshbazzar, the princ of judah.

1:9 and thi is the number of them: thirti charger of gold, a
thousand charger of silver, nine and twenti knives, 1:10 thirty
bason of gold, silver bason of a second sort four hundr and ten,
and other vessel a thousand.

1:11 all the vessel of gold and of silver were five thousand and four
hundred. all these did sheshbazzar bring up with them of the captivity
that were brought up from babylon unto jerusalem.

2:1 now these are the children of the provinc that went up out of the
captivity, of those which had been carri away, whom nebuchadnezzar
th king of babylon had carri away unto babylon, and came again unto
jerusalem and judah, everi one unto hi city; 2:2 which came with
zerubbabel: jeshua, nehemiah, seraiah, reelaiah, mordecai, bilshan,
mizpar, bigvai, rehum, baanah. the number of the men of the peopl of
israel: 2:3 the children of parosh, two thousand an hundr seventy
and two.

2:4 the children of shephatiah, three hundr seventi and two.

2:5 the children of arah, seven hundr seventi and five.

2:6 the children of pahathmoab, of the children of jeshua and joab,
two thousand eight hundr and twelve.

2:7 the children of elam, a thousand two hundr fifti and four.

2:8 the children of zattu, nine hundr forti and five.

2:9 the children of zaccai, seven hundr and threescore.

2:10 the children of bani, six hundr forti and two.

2:11 the children of bebai, six hundr twenti and three.

2:12 the children of azgad, a thousand two hundr twenti and two.

2:13 the children of adonikam, six hundr sixti and six.

2:14 the children of bigvai, two thousand fifti and six.

2:15 the children of adin, four hundr fifti and four.

2:16 the children of ater of hezekiah, nineti and eight.

2:17 the children of bezai, three hundr twenti and three.

2:18 the children of jorah, an hundr and twelve.

2:19 the children of hashum, two hundr twenti and three.

2:20 the children of gibbar, nineti and five.

2:21 the children of bethlehem, an hundr twenti and three.

2:22 the men of netophah, fifti and six.

2:23 the men of anathoth, an hundr twenti and eight.

2:24 the children of azmaveth, forti and two.

2:25 the children of kirjatharim, chephirah, and beeroth, seven
hundr and forti and three.

2:26 the children of ramah and gaba, six hundr twenti and one.

2:27 the men of michmas, an hundr twenti and two.

2:28 the men of bethel and ai, two hundr twenti and three.

2:29 the children of nebo, fifti and two.

2:30 the children of magbish, an hundr fifti and six.

2:31 the children of the other elam, a thousand two hundr fifti and
four.

2:32 the children of harim, three hundr and twenty.

2:33 the children of lod, hadid, and ono, seven hundr twenti and
five.

2:34 the children of jericho, three hundr forti and five.

2:35 the children of senaah, three thousand and six hundr and
thirty.

2:36 the priests: the children of jedaiah, of the hous of jeshua,
nin hundr seventi and three.

2:37 the children of immer, a thousand fifti and two.

2:38 the children of pashur, a thousand two hundr forti and seven.

2:39 the children of harim, a thousand and seventeen.

2:40 the levites: the children of jeshua and kadmiel, of the children
of hodaviah, seventi and four.

2:41 the singers: the children of asaph, an hundr twenti and eight.

2:42 the children of the porters: the children of shallum, the
children of ater, the children of talmon, the children of akkub, the
children of hatita, the children of shobai, in all an hundr thirty
and nine.

2:43 the nethinims: the children of ziha, the children of hasupha, the
children of tabbaoth, 2:44 the children of keros, the children of
siaha, the children of padon, 2:45 the children of lebanah, the
children of hagabah, the children of akkub, 2:46 the children of
hagab, the children of shalmai, the children of hanan, 2:47 the
children of giddel, the children of gahar, the children of reaiah,
2:48 the children of rezin, the children of nekoda, the children of
gazzam, 2:49 the children of uzza, the children of paseah, the
children of besai, 2:50 the children of asnah, the children of
mehunim, the children of nephusim, 2:51 the children of bakbuk, the
children of hakupha, the children of harhur, 2:52 the children of
bazluth, the children of mehida, the children of harsha, 2:53 the
children of barkos, the children of sisera, the children of thamah,
2:54 the children of neziah, the children of hatipha.

2:55 the children of solomon' servants: the children of sotai, the
children of sophereth, the children of peruda, 2:56 the children of
jaalah, the children of darkon, the children of giddel, 2:57 the
children of shephatiah, the children of hattil, the children of
pochereth of zebaim, the children of ami.

2:58 all the nethinims, and the children of solomon' servants, were
thre hundr nineti and two.

2:59 and these were they which went up from telmelah, telharsa,
cherub, addan, and immer: but they could not shew their father's
house, and their seed, whether they were of israel: 2:60 the children
of delaiah, the children of tobiah, the children of nekoda, six
hundr fifti and two.

2:61 and of the children of the priests: the children of habaiah, the
children of koz, the children of barzillai; which took a wife of the
daught of barzillai the gileadite, and wa call after their name:
2:62 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by
genealogy, but they were not found: therefor were they, as polluted,
put from the priesthood.

2:63 and the tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat of the
most holi things, till there stood up a priest with urim and with
thummim.

2:64 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three
hundr and threescore, 2:65 besid their servant and their maids, of
whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirti and seven: and
ther were among them two hundr sing men and sing women.

2:66 their hors were seven hundr thirti and six; their mules, two
hundr forti and five; 2:67 their camels, four hundr thirti and
five; their asses, six thousand seven hundr and twenty.

2:68 and some of the chief of the fathers, when they came to the house
of the lord which is at jerusalem, offer freeli for the hous of god
to set it up in hi place: 2:69 they gave after their abil unto the
treasur of the work threescor and one thousand dram of gold, and
fiv thousand pound of silver, and one hundr priests' garments.

2:70 So the priests, and the levites, and some of the people, and the
singers, and the porters, and the nethinims, dwelt in their cities,
and all israel in their cities.

3:1 and when the seventh month wa come, and the children of israel
wer in the cities, the peopl gather themselv togeth as one man
to jerusalem.

3:2 then stood up jeshua the son of jozadak, and hi brethren the
priests, and zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, and hi brethren, and
build the altar of the god of israel, to offer burnt offerings
thereon, as it is written in the law of mose the man of god.

3:3 and they set the altar upon hi bases; for fear wa upon them
becaus of the peopl of those countries: and they offer burnt
off thereon unto the lord, even burnt offer morn and
evening.

3:4 they kept also the feast of tabernacles, as it is written, and
off the daili burnt offer by number, accord to the custom,
a the duti of everi day required; 3:5 and afterward offer the
continu burnt offering, both of the new moons, and of all the set
feast of the lord that were consecrated, and of everi one that
willingli offer a freewil offer unto the lord.

3:6 from the first day of the seventh month began they to offer burnt
off unto the lord. but the foundat of the templ of the lord
wa not yet laid.

3:7 they gave money also unto the masons, and to the carpenters; and
meat, and drink, and oil, unto them of zidon, and to them of tyre, to
br cedar tree from lebanon to the sea of joppa, accord to the
grant that they had of cyru king of persia.

3:8 now in the second year of their come unto the hous of god at
jerusalem, in the second month, began zerubbabel the son of shealtiel,
and jeshua the son of jozadak, and the remnant of their brethren the
priest and the levites, and all they that were come out of the
capt unto jerusalem; and appoint the levites, from twenti years
old and upward, to set forward the work of the hous of the lord.

3:9 then stood jeshua with hi son and hi brethren, kadmiel and his
sons, the son of judah, together, to set forward the workmen in the
hous of god: the son of henadad, with their son and their brethren
th levites.

3:10 and when the builder laid the foundat of the templ of the
lord, they set the priest in their apparel with trumpets, and the
levit the son of asaph with cymbals, to prais the lord, after the
ordin of david king of israel.

3:11 and they sang togeth by cours in prais and give thanks
unto the lord; becaus he is good, for hi merci endureth for ever
toward israel.

and all the peopl shout with a great shout, when they prais the
lord, becaus the foundat of the hous of the lord wa laid.

3:12 but mani of the priest and levit and chief of the fathers, who
wer ancient men, that had seen the first house, when the foundation
of thi hous wa laid befor their eyes, wept with a loud voice; and
mani shout aloud for joy: 3:13 So that the peopl could not discern
th nois of the shout of joy from the nois of the weep of the
people: for the peopl shout with a loud shout, and the nois was
heard afar off.

4:1 now when the adversari of judah and benjamin heard that the
children of the captiv build the templ unto the lord god of
israel; 4:2 then they came to zerubbabel, and to the chief of the
fathers, and said unto them, let us build with you: for we seek your
god, as ye do; and we do sacrific unto him sinc the day of
esarhaddon king of assur, which brought us up hither.

4:3 but zerubbabel, and jeshua, and the rest of the chief of the
fath of israel, said unto them, Ye have noth to do with us to
build an hous unto our god; but we ourselv togeth will build unto
th lord god of israel, as king cyru the king of persia hath
command us.

4:4 then the peopl of the land weaken the hand of the peopl of
judah, and troubl them in building, 4:5 and hire counsellors
against them, to frustrat their purpose, all the day of cyru king
of persia, even until the reign of dariu king of persia.

4:6 and in the reign of ahasuerus, in the begin of hi reign,
wrot they unto him an accus against the inhabit of judah and
jerusalem.

4:7 and in the day of artaxerx wrote bishlam, mithredath, tabeel,
and the rest of their companions, unto artaxerx king of persia; and
th write of the letter wa written in the syrian tongue, and
interpret in the syrian tongue.

4:8 rehum the chancellor and shimshai the scribe wrote a letter
against jerusalem to artaxerx the king in thi sort: 4:9 then wrote
rehum the chancellor, and shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their
companions; the dinaites, the apharsathchites, the tarpelites, the
apharsites, the archevites, the babylonians, the susanchites, the
dehavites, and the elamites, 4:10 and the rest of the nation whom the
great and nobl asnapp brought over, and set in the citi of
samaria, and the rest that are on thi side the river, and at such a
time.

4:11 thi is the copi of the letter that they sent unto him, even unto
artaxerx the king; thi servant the men on thi side the river, and
at such a time.

4:12 Be it known unto the king, that the jew which came up from thee
to us are come unto jerusalem, build the rebelli and the bad
city, and have set up the wall thereof, and join the foundations.

4:13 Be it known now unto the king, that, if thi citi be builded, and
th wall set up again, then will they not pay toll, tribute, and
custom, and so thou shalt endamag the revenu of the kings.

4:14 now becaus we have mainten from the king' palace, and it
wa not meet for us to see the king' dishonour, therefor have we
sent and certifi the king; 4:15 that search may be made in the book
of the record of thi fathers: so shalt thou find in the book of the
records, and know that thi citi is a rebelli city, and hurtful
unto king and provinces, and that they have move sedit within the
sam of old time: for which caus wa thi citi destroyed.

4:16 We certifi the king that, if thi citi be build again, and the
wal thereof set up, by thi mean thou shalt have no portion on this
sid the river.

4:17 then sent the king an answer unto rehum the chancellor, and to
shimshai the scribe, and to the rest of their companion that dwell in
samaria, and unto the rest beyond the river, peace, and at such a
time.

4:18 the letter which ye sent unto us hath been plainli read before
me.

4:19 and I commanded, and search hath been made, and it is found that
thi citi of old time hath made insurrect against kings, and that
rebellion and sedit have been made therein.

4:20 there have been mighti king also over jerusalem, which have
rul over all countri beyond the river; and toll, tribute, and
custom, wa paid unto them.

4:21 give ye now command to caus these men to cease, and that
thi citi be not builded, until anoth command shall be given
from me.

4:22 take heed now that ye fail not to do this: whi should damag grow
to the hurt of the kings?  4:23 now when the copi of king artaxerxes'
lett wa read befor rehum, and shimshai the scribe, and their
companions, they went up in hast to jerusalem unto the jews, and made
them to ceas by forc and power.

4:24 then ceas the work of the hous of god which is at jerusalem.
so it ceas unto the second year of the reign of dariu king of
persia.

5:1 then the prophets, haggai the prophet, and zechariah the son of
iddo, prophesi unto the jew that were in judah and jerusalem in the
nam of the god of israel, even unto them.

5:2 then rose up zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, and jeshua the son
of jozadak, and began to build the hous of god which is at jerusalem:
and with them were the prophet of god help them.

5:3 At the same time came to them tatnai, governor on thi side the
river, and shetharboznai and their companions, and said thu unto
them, who hath command you to build thi house, and to make up this
wall?  5:4 then said we unto them after thi manner, what are the
nam of the men that make thi building?  5:5 but the eye of their
god wa upon the elder of the jews, that they could not caus them to
cease, till the matter came to darius: and then they return answer
bi letter concern thi matter.

5:6 the copi of the letter that tatnai, governor on thi side the
river, and shetharboznai and hi companion the apharsachites, which
wer on thi side the river, sent unto dariu the king: 5:7 they sent
a letter unto him, wherein wa written thus; unto dariu the king, all
peace.

5:8 Be it known unto the king, that we went into the provinc of
judea, to the hous of the great god, which is build with great
stones, and timber is laid in the walls, and thi work goeth fast on,
and prospereth in their hands.

5:9 then ask we those elders, and said unto them thus, who commanded
y to build thi house, and to make up these walls?  5:10 We asked
their name also, to certifi thee, that we might write the name of
th men that were the chief of them.

5:11 and thu they return us answer, saying, We are the servant of
th god of heaven and earth, and build the hous that wa builded
thes mani year ago, which a great king of israel build and set up.

5:12 but after that our father had provok the god of heaven unto
wrath, he gave them into the hand of nebuchadnezzar the king of
babylon, the chaldean, who destroy thi house, and carri the
peopl away into babylon.

5:13 but in the first year of cyru the king of babylon the same king
cyru made a decre to build thi hous of god.

5:14 and the vessel also of gold and silver of the hous of god,
which nebuchadnezzar took out of the templ that wa in jerusalem, and
brought them into the templ of babylon, those did cyru the king take
out of the templ of babylon, and they were deliv unto one, whose
nam wa sheshbazzar, whom he had made governor; 5:15 and said unto
him, take these vessels, go, carri them into the templ that is in
jerusalem, and let the hous of god be build in hi place.

5:16 then came the same sheshbazzar, and laid the foundat of the
hous of god which is in jerusalem: and sinc that time even until now
hath it been in building, and yet it is not finished.

5:17 now therefore, if it seem good to the king, let there be search
mad in the king' treasur house, which is there at babylon, whether
it be so, that a decre wa made of cyru the king to build thi house
of god at jerusalem, and let the king send hi pleasur to us
concern thi matter.

6:1 then dariu the king made a decree, and search wa made in the
hous of the rolls, where the treasur were laid up in babylon.

6:2 and there wa found at achmetha, in the palac that is in the
provinc of the medes, a roll, and therein wa a record thu written:
6:3 In the first year of cyru the king the same cyru the king made a
decre concern the hous of god at jerusalem, let the hous be
builded, the place where they offer sacrifices, and let the
found thereof be strongli laid; the height thereof threescore
cubits, and the breadth thereof threescor cubits; 6:4 with three rows
of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expens be
given out of the king' house: 6:5 and also let the golden and silver
vessel of the hous of god, which nebuchadnezzar took forth out of
th templ which is at jerusalem, and brought unto babylon, be
restored, and brought again unto the templ which is at jerusalem,
everi one to hi place, and place them in the hous of god.

6:6 now therefore, tatnai, governor beyond the river, shetharboznai,
and your companion the apharsachites, which are beyond the river, be
y far from thence: 6:7 let the work of thi hous of god alone; let
th governor of the jew and the elder of the jew build thi house
of god in hi place.

6:8 moreov I make a decre what ye shall do to the elder of these
jew for the build of thi hous of god: that of the king' goods,
even of the tribut beyond the river, forthwith expens be given unto
thes men, that they be not hindered.

6:9 and that which they have need of, both young bullocks, and rams,
and lambs, for the burnt offer of the god of heaven, wheat, salt,
wine, and oil, accord to the appoint of the priest which are
at jerusalem, let it be given them day by day without fail: 6:10 that
they may offer sacrific of sweet savour unto the god of heaven, and
pray for the life of the king, and of hi sons.

6:11 also I have made a decree, that whosoev shall alter thi word,
let timber be pull down from hi house, and be set up, let him be
hang thereon; and let hi hous be made a dunghil for this.

6:12 and the god that hath caus hi name to dwell there destroy all
k and people, that shall put to their hand to alter and to destroy
thi hous of god which is at jerusalem. I dariu have made a decree;
let it be done with speed.

6:13 then tatnai, governor on thi side the river, shetharboznai, and
their companions, accord to that which dariu the king had sent, so
they did speedily.

6:14 and the elder of the jew builded, and they prosper through
th prophesi of haggai the prophet and zechariah the son of iddo.
and they builded, and finish it, accord to the command of the
god of israel, and accord to the command of cyrus, and darius,
and artaxerx king of persia.

6:15 and thi hous wa finish on the third day of the month adar,
which wa in the sixth year of the reign of dariu the king.

6:16 and the children of israel, the priests, and the levites, and the
rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedic of this
hous of god with joy.

6:17 and offer at the dedic of thi hous of god an hundred
bullocks, two hundr rams, four hundr lambs; and for a sin offering
for all israel, twelv he goats, accord to the number of the tribes
of israel.

6:18 and they set the priest in their divisions, and the levit in
their courses, for the servic of god, which is at jerusalem; as it is
written in the book of moses.

6:19 and the children of the captiv kept the passov upon the
fourteenth day of the first month.

6:20 for the priest and the levit were purifi together, all of
them were pure, and kill the passov for all the children of the
captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.

6:21 and the children of israel, which were come again out of
captivity, and all such as had separ themselv unto them from the
filthi of the heathen of the land, to seek the lord god of israel,
did eat, 6:22 and kept the feast of unleaven bread seven day with
joy: for the lord had made them joyful, and turn the heart of the
k of assyria unto them, to strengthen their hand in the work of
th hous of god, the god of israel.

7:1 now after these things, in the reign of artaxerx king of persia,
ezra the son of seraiah, the son of azariah, the son of hilkiah, 7:2
the son of shallum, the son of zadok, the son of ahitub, 7:3 the son
of amariah, the son of azariah, the son of meraioth, 7:4 the son of
zerahiah, the son of uzzi, the son of bukki, 7:5 the son of abishua,
th son of phinehas, the son of eleazar, the son of aaron the chief
priest: 7:6 thi ezra went up from babylon; and he wa a readi scribe
in the law of moses, which the lord god of israel had given: and the
k grant him all hi request, accord to the hand of the lord
hi god upon him.

7:7 and there went up some of the children of israel, and of the
priests, and the levites, and the singers, and the porters, and the
nethinims, unto jerusalem, in the seventh year of artaxerx the king.

7:8 and he came to jerusalem in the fifth month, which wa in the
seventh year of the king.

7:9 for upon the first day of the first month began he to go up from
babylon, and on the first day of the fifth month came he to jerusalem,
accord to the good hand of hi god upon him.

7:10 for ezra had prepar hi heart to seek the law of the lord, and
to do it, and to teach in israel statut and judgments.

7:11 now thi is the copi of the letter that the king artaxerx gave
unto ezra the priest, the scribe, even a scribe of the word of the
command of the lord, and of hi statut to israel.

7:12 artaxerxes, king of kings, unto ezra the priest, a scribe of the
law of the god of heaven, perfect peace, and at such a time.

7:13 I make a decree, that all they of the peopl of israel, and of
hi priest and levites, in my realm, which are mind of their own
freewil to go up to jerusalem, go with thee.

7:14 forasmuch as thou art sent of the king, and of hi seven
counsellors, to enquir concern judah and jerusalem, accord to
th law of thi god which is in thine hand; 7:15 and to carri the
silv and gold, which the king and hi counsellor have freely
off unto the god of israel, whose habit is in jerusalem, 7:16
and all the silver and gold that thou canst find in all the province
of babylon, with the freewil offer of the people, and of the
priests, offer willingli for the hous of their god which is in
jerusalem: 7:17 that thou mayest buy speedili with thi money
bullocks, rams, lambs, with their meat offer and their drink
offerings, and offer them upon the altar of the hous of your god
which is in jerusalem.

7:18 and whatsoev shall seem good to thee, and to thi brethren, to
do with the rest of the silver and the gold, that do after the will of
your god.

7:19 the vessel also that are given thee for the servic of the house
of thi god, those deliv thou befor the god of jerusalem.

7:20 and whatsoev more shall be need for the hous of thi god,
which thou shalt have occas to bestow, bestow it out of the king's
treasur house.

7:21 and I, even I artaxerx the king, do make a decre to all the
treasur which are beyond the river, that whatsoev ezra the
priest, the scribe of the law of the god of heaven, shall requir of
you, it be done speedily, 7:22 unto an hundr talent of silver, and
to an hundr measur of wheat, and to an hundr bath of wine, and
to an hundr bath of oil, and salt without prescrib how much.

7:23 whatsoev is command by the god of heaven, let it be
dilig done for the hous of the god of heaven: for whi should
ther be wrath against the realm of the king and hi sons?  7:24 also
w certifi you, that touch ani of the priest and levites, singers,
porters, nethinims, or minist of thi hous of god, it shall not be
law to impos toll, tribute, or custom, upon them.

7:25 and thou, ezra, after the wisdom of thi god, that is in thine
hand, set magistr and judges, which may judg all the peopl that
ar beyond the river, all such as know the law of thi god; and teach
y them that know them not.

7:26 and whosoev will not do the law of thi god, and the law of the
king, let judgment be execut speedili upon him, whether it be unto
death, or to banishment, or to confisc of goods, or to
imprisonment.

7:27 bless be the lord god of our fathers, which hath put such a
th as thi in the king' heart, to beautifi the hous of the lord
which is in jerusalem: 7:28 and hath extend merci unto me befor the
king, and hi counsellors, and befor all the king' mighti princes.
and I wa strengthen as the hand of the lord my god wa upon me, and
i gather togeth out of israel chief men to go up with me.

8:1 these are now the chief of their fathers, and thi is the
genealog of them that went up with me from babylon, in the reign of
artaxerx the king.

8:2 Of the son of phinehas; gershom: of the son of ithamar; daniel:
of the son of david; hattush.

8:3 Of the son of shechaniah, of the son of pharosh; zechariah: and
with him were reckon by genealog of the male an hundr and fifty.

8:4 Of the son of pahathmoab; elihoenai the son of zerahiah, and with
him two hundr males.

8:5 Of the son of shechaniah; the son of jahaziel, and with him three
hundr males.

8:6 Of the son also of adin; ebe the son of jonathan, and with him
fifti males.

8:7 and of the son of elam; jeshaiah the son of athaliah, and with
him seventi males.

8:8 and of the son of shephatiah; zebadiah the son of michael, and
with him fourscor males.

8:9 Of the son of joab; obadiah the son of jehiel, and with him two
hundr and eighteen males.

8:10 and of the son of shelomith; the son of josiphiah, and with him
an hundr and threescor males.

8:11 and of the son of bebai; zechariah the son of bebai, and with
him twenti and eight males.

8:12 and of the son of azgad; johanan the son of hakkatan, and with
him an hundr and ten males.

8:13 and of the last son of adonikam, whose name are these,
eliphelet, jeiel, and shemaiah, and with them threescor males.

8:14 Of the son also of bigvai; uthai, and zabbud, and with them
seventi males.

8:15 and I gather them togeth to the river that runneth to ahava;
and there abod we in tent three days: and I view the people, and
th priests, and found there none of the son of levi.

8:16 then sent I for eliezer, for ariel, for shemaiah, and for
elnathan, and for jarib, and for elnathan, and for nathan, and for
zechariah, and for meshullam, chief men; also for joiarib, and for
elnathan, men of understanding.

8:17 and I sent them with command unto iddo the chief at the place
casiphia, and I told them what they should say unto iddo, and to his
brethren the nethinims, at the place casiphia, that they should bring
unto us minist for the hous of our god.

8:18 and by the good hand of our god upon us they brought us a man of
understanding, of the son of mahli, the son of levi, the son of
israel; and sherebiah, with hi son and hi brethren, eighteen; 8:19
and hashabiah, and with him jeshaiah of the son of merari, his
brethren and their sons, twenty; 8:20 also of the nethinims, whom
david and the princ had appoint for the servic of the levites,
two hundr and twenti nethinims: all of them were express by name.

8:21 then I proclaim a fast there, at the river of ahava, that we
might afflict ourselv befor our god, to seek of him a right way for
us, and for our littl ones, and for all our substance.

8:22 for I wa asham to requir of the king a band of soldier and
horsemen to help us against the enemi in the way: becaus we had
spoken unto the king, saying, the hand of our god is upon all them for
good that seek him; but hi power and hi wrath is against all them
that forsak him.

8:23 So we fast and besought our god for this: and he wa intreated
of us.

8:24 then I separ twelv of the chief of the priests, sherebiah,
hashabiah, and ten of their brethren with them, 8:25 and weigh unto
them the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, even the offer of
th hous of our god, which the king, and hi counsellors, and his
lords, and all israel there present, had offered: 8:26 I even weighed
unto their hand six hundr and fifti talent of silver, and silver
vessel an hundr talents, and of gold an hundr talents; 8:27 also
twenti bason of gold, of a thousand drams; and two vessel of fine
copper, preciou as gold.

8:28 and I said unto them, Ye are holi unto the lord; the vessel are
holi also; and the silver and the gold are a freewil offer unto
th lord god of your fathers.

8:29 watch ye, and keep them, until ye weigh them befor the chief of
th priest and the levites, and chief of the father of israel, at
jerusalem, in the chamber of the hous of the lord.

8:30 So took the priest and the levit the weight of the silver, and
th gold, and the vessels, to bring them to jerusalem unto the house
of our god.

8:31 then we depart from the river of ahava on the twelfth day of
th first month, to go unto jerusalem: and the hand of our god was
upon us, and he deliv us from the hand of the enemy, and of such
a lay in wait by the way.

8:32 and we came to jerusalem, and abod there three days.

8:33 now on the fourth day wa the silver and the gold and the vessels
weigh in the hous of our god by the hand of meremoth the son of
uriah the priest; and with him wa eleazar the son of phinehas; and
with them wa jozabad the son of jeshua, and noadiah the son of
binnui, levites; 8:34 By number and by weight of everi one: and all
th weight wa written at that time.

8:35 also the children of those that had been carri away, which were
com out of the captivity, offer burnt offer unto the god of
israel, twelv bullock for all israel, nineti and six rams, seventy
and seven lambs, twelv he goat for a sin offering: all thi wa a
burnt offer unto the lord.

8:36 and they deliv the king' commiss unto the king's
lieutenants, and to the governor on thi side the river: and they
furth the people, and the hous of god.

9:1 now when these thing were done, the princ came to me, saying,
th peopl of israel, and the priests, and the levites, have not
separ themselv from the peopl of the lands, do accord to
their abominations, even of the canaanites, the hittites, the
perizzites, the jebusites, the ammonites, the moabites, the egyptians,
and the amorites.

9:2 for they have taken of their daughter for themselves, and for
their sons: so that the holi seed have mingl themselv with the
peopl of those lands: yea, the hand of the princ and ruler hath
been chief in thi trespass.

9:3 and when I heard thi thing, I rent my garment and my mantle, and
pluck off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down
astonied.

9:4 then were assembl unto me everi one that trembl at the words
of the god of israel, becaus of the transgress of those that had
been carri away; and I sat astoni until the even sacrifice.

9:5 and at the even sacrific I aros up from my heaviness; and
hav rent my garment and my mantle, I fell upon my knees, and spread
out my hand unto the lord my god, 9:6 and said, O my god, I am
asham and blush to lift up my face to thee, my god: for our
iniqu are increas over our head, and our trespass is grown up
unto the heavens.

9:7 sinc the day of our father have we been in a great trespass
unto thi day; and for our iniqu have we, our kings, and our
priests, been deliv into the hand of the king of the lands, to
th sword, to captivity, and to a spoil, and to confus of face, as
it is thi day.

9:8 and now for a littl space grace hath been shew from the lord
our god, to leav us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in his
holi place, that our god may lighten our eyes, and give us a little
reviv in our bondage.

9:9 for we were bondmen; yet our god hath not forsaken us in our
bondage, but hath extend merci unto us in the sight of the king of
persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the hous of our god, and to
repair the desol thereof, and to give us a wall in judah and in
jerusalem.

9:10 and now, O our god, what shall we say after this? for we have
forsaken thi commandments, 9:11 which thou hast command by thy
serv the prophets, saying, the land, unto which ye go to possess
it, is an unclean land with the filthi of the peopl of the lands,
with their abominations, which have fill it from one end to another
with their uncleanness.

9:12 now therefor give not your daughter unto their sons, neither
tak their daughter unto your sons, nor seek their peac or their
wealth for ever: that ye may be strong, and eat the good of the land,
and leav it for an inherit to your children for ever.

9:13 and after all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for
our great trespass, see that thou our god hast punish us less
than our iniqu deserve, and hast given us such deliver as
this; 9:14 should we again break thi commandments, and join in
affin with the peopl of these abominations? wouldest not thou be
angri with us till thou hadst consum us, so that there should be no
remn nor escaping?  9:15 O lord god of israel, thou art righteous:
for we remain yet escaped, as it is thi day: behold, we are before
the in our trespasses: for we cannot stand befor thee becaus of
this.

10:1 now when ezra had prayed, and when he had confessed, weep and
cast himself down befor the hous of god, there assembl unto him
out of israel a veri great congreg of men and women and children:
for the peopl wept veri sore.

10:2 and shechaniah the son of jehiel, one of the son of elam,
answ and said unto ezra, We have trespass against our god, and
hav taken strang wive of the peopl of the land: yet now there is
hop in israel concern thi thing.

10:3 now therefor let us make a coven with our god to put away all
th wives, and such as are born of them, accord to the counsel of
mi lord, and of those that trembl at the command of our god; and
let it be done accord to the law.

10:4 arise; for thi matter belongeth unto thee: we also will be with
thee: be of good courage, and do it.

10:5 then aros ezra, and made the chief priests, the levites, and all
israel, to swear that they should do accord to thi word. and they
sware.

10:6 then ezra rose up from befor the hous of god, and went into the
chamb of johanan the son of eliashib: and when he came thither, he
did eat no bread, nor drink water: for he mourn becaus of the
transgress of them that had been carri away.

10:7 and they made proclam throughout judah and jerusalem unto
al the children of the captivity, that they should gather themselves
togeth unto jerusalem; 10:8 and that whosoev would not come within
thre days, accord to the counsel of the princ and the elders,
al hi substanc should be forfeited, and himself separ from the
congreg of those that had been carri away.

10:9 then all the men of judah and benjamin gather themselves
togeth unto jerusalem within three days. It wa the ninth month, on
th twentieth day of the month; and all the peopl sat in the street
of the hous of god, trembl becaus of thi matter, and for the
great rain.

10:10 and ezra the priest stood up, and said unto them, Ye have
transgressed, and have taken strang wives, to increas the trespass
of israel.

10:11 now therefor make confess unto the lord god of your fathers,
and do hi pleasure: and separ yourselv from the peopl of the
land, and from the strang wives.

10:12 then all the congreg answer and said with a loud voice,
a thou hast said, so must we do.

10:13 but the peopl are many, and it is a time of much rain, and we
ar not abl to stand without, neither is thi a work of one day or
two: for we are mani that have transgress in thi thing.

10:14 let now our ruler of all the congreg stand, and let all
them which have taken strang wive in our citi come at appointed
times, and with them the elder of everi city, and the judg thereof,
until the fierc wrath of our god for thi matter be turn from us.

10:15 onli jonathan the son of asahel and jahaziah the son of tikvah
wer employ about thi matter: and meshullam and shabbethai the
levit help them.

10:16 and the children of the captiv did so. and ezra the priest,
with certain chief of the fathers, after the hous of their fathers,
and all of them by their names, were separated, and sat down in the
first day of the tenth month to examin the matter.

10:17 and they made an end with all the men that had taken strange
w by the first day of the first month.

10:18 and among the son of the priest there were found that had
taken strang wives: namely, of the son of jeshua the son of jozadak,
and hi brethren; maaseiah, and eliezer, and jarib, and gedaliah.

10:19 and they gave their hand that they would put away their wives;
and be guilty, they offer a ram of the flock for their trespass.

10:20 and of the son of immer; hanani, and zebadiah.

10:21 and of the son of harim; maaseiah, and elijah, and shemaiah,
and jehiel, and uzziah.

10:22 and of the son of pashur; elioenai, maaseiah, ishmael,
nethaneel, jozabad, and elasah.

10:23 also of the levites; jozabad, and shimei, and kelaiah, (the same
i kelita,) pethahiah, judah, and eliezer.

10:24 Of the singer also; eliashib: and of the porters; shallum, and
telem, and uri.

10:25 moreov of israel: of the son of parosh; ramiah, and jeziah,
and malchiah, and miamin, and eleazar, and malchijah, and benaiah.

10:26 and of the son of elam; mattaniah, zechariah, and jehiel, and
abdi, and jeremoth, and eliah.

10:27 and of the son of zattu; elioenai, eliashib, mattaniah, and
jeremoth, and zabad, and aziza.

10:28 Of the son also of bebai; jehohanan, hananiah, zabbai, and
athlai.

10:29 and of the son of bani; meshullam, malluch, and adaiah, jashub,
and sheal, and ramoth.

10:30 and of the son of pahathmoab; adna, and chelal, benaiah,
maaseiah, mattaniah, bezaleel, and binnui, and manasseh.

10:31 and of the son of harim; eliezer, ishijah, malchiah, shemaiah,
shimeon, 10:32 benjamin, malluch, and shemariah.

10:33 Of the son of hashum; mattenai, mattathah, zabad, eliphelet,
jeremai, manasseh, and shimei.

10:34 Of the son of bani; maadai, amram, and uel, 10:35 benaiah,
bedeiah, chelluh, 10:36 vaniah, meremoth, eliashib, 10:37 mattaniah,
mattenai, and jaasau, 10:38 and bani, and binnui, shimei, 10:39 and
shelemiah, and nathan, and adaiah, 10:40 machnadebai, shashai, sharai,
10:41 azareel, and shelemiah, shemariah, 10:42 shallum, amariah, and
joseph.

10:43 Of the son of nebo; jeiel, mattithiah, zabad, zebina, jadau,
and joel, benaiah.

10:44 all these had taken strang wives: and some of them had wive by
whom they had children.




th book of nehemiah


1:1 the word of nehemiah the son of hachaliah. and it came to pass
in the month chisleu, in the twentieth year, as I wa in shushan the
palace, 1:2 that hanani, one of my brethren, came, he and certain men
of judah; and I ask them concern the jew that had escaped, which
wer left of the captivity, and concern jerusalem.

1:3 and they said unto me, the remnant that are left of the captivity
ther in the provinc are in great afflict and reproach: the wall
of jerusalem also is broken down, and the gate thereof are burned
with fire.

1:4 and it came to pass, when I heard these words, that I sat down and
wept, and mourn certain days, and fasted, and pray befor the god
of heaven, 1:5 and said, I beseech thee, O lord god of heaven, the
great and terribl god, that keepeth coven and merci for them that
lov him and observ hi commandments: 1:6 let thine ear now be
attentive, and thine eye open, that thou mayest hear the prayer of
thi servant, which I pray befor thee now, day and night, for the
children of israel thi servants, and confess the sin of the children
of israel, which we have sin against thee: both I and my father's
hous have sinned.

1:7 We have dealt veri corruptli against thee, and have not kept the
commandments, nor the statutes, nor the judgments, which thou
commandedst thi servant moses.

1:8 remember, I beseech thee, the word that thou commandedst thy
serv moses, saying, If ye transgress, I will scatter you abroad
among the nations: 1:9 but if ye turn unto me, and keep my
commandments, and do them; though there were of you cast out unto the
uttermost part of the heaven, yet will I gather them from thence, and
wil bring them unto the place that I have chosen to set my name
there.

1:10 now these are thi servant and thi people, whom thou hast
redeem by thi great power, and by thi strong hand.

1:11 O lord, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attent to the
pray of thi servant, and to the prayer of thi servants, who desire
to fear thi name: and prosper, I pray thee, thi servant thi day, and
grant him merci in the sight of thi man. for I wa the king's
cupbearer.

2:1 and it came to pass in the month nisan, in the twentieth year of
artaxerx the king, that wine wa befor him: and I took up the wine,
and gave it unto the king. now I had not been beforetim sad in his
presence.

2:2 wherefor the king said unto me, whi is thi counten sad,
se thou art not sick? thi is noth els but sorrow of heart.
then I wa veri sore afraid, 2:3 and said unto the king, let the king
liv for ever: whi should not my counten be sad, when the city,
th place of my fathers' sepulchres, lieth waste, and the gates
thereof are consum with fire?  2:4 then the king said unto me, for
what dost thou make request? So I pray to the god of heaven.

2:5 and I said unto the king, If it pleas the king, and if thy
serv have found favour in thi sight, that thou wouldest send me
unto judah, unto the citi of my fathers' sepulchres, that I may build
it.

2:6 and the king said unto me, (the queen also sit by him,) for
how long shall thi journey be? and when wilt thou return? So it
pleas the king to send me; and I set him a time.

2:7 moreov I said unto the king, If it pleas the king, let letters
b given me to the governor beyond the river, that they may convey me
ov till I come into judah; 2:8 and a letter unto asaph the keeper of
th king' forest, that he may give me timber to make beam for the
gat of the palac which appertain to the house, and for the wall
of the city, and for the hous that I shall enter into. and the king
grant me, accord to the good hand of my god upon me.

2:9 then I came to the governor beyond the river, and gave them the
king' letters. now the king had sent captain of the armi and
horsemen with me.

2:10 when sanballat the horonite, and tobiah the servant, the
ammonite, heard of it, it griev them exceedingli that there wa come
a man to seek the welfar of the children of israel.

2:11 So I came to jerusalem, and wa there three days.

2:12 and I aros in the night, I and some few men with me; neither
told I ani man what my god had put in my heart to do at jerusalem:
neith wa there ani beast with me, save the beast that I rode upon.

2:13 and I went out by night by the gate of the valley, even before
th dragon well, and to the dung port, and view the wall of
jerusalem, which were broken down, and the gate thereof were consumed
with fire.

2:14 then I went on to the gate of the fountain, and to the king's
pool: but there wa no place for the beast that wa under me to pass.

2:15 then went I up in the night by the brook, and view the wall,
and turn back, and enter by the gate of the valley, and so
returned.

2:16 and the ruler knew not whither I went, or what I did; neither
had I as yet told it to the jews, nor to the priests, nor to the
nobles, nor to the rulers, nor to the rest that did the work.

2:17 then said I unto them, Ye see the distress that we are in, how
jerusalem lieth waste, and the gate thereof are burn with fire:
come, and let us build up the wall of jerusalem, that we be no more a
reproach.

2:18 then I told them of the hand of my god which wa good upon me; as
also the king' word that he had spoken unto me. and they said, let
u rise up and build. So they strengthen their hand for thi good
work.

2:19 but when sanballat the horonite, and tobiah the servant, the
ammonite, and geshem the arabian, heard it, they laugh us to scorn,
and despis us, and said, what is thi thing that ye do? will ye
rebel against the king?  2:20 then answer I them, and said unto
them, the god of heaven, he will prosper us; therefor we hi servants
wil aris and build: but ye have no portion, nor right, nor memorial,
in jerusalem.

3:1 then eliashib the high priest rose up with hi brethren the
priests, and they build the sheep gate; they sanctifi it, and set
up the door of it; even unto the tower of meah they sanctifi it,
unto the tower of hananeel.

3:2 and next unto him build the men of jericho. and next to them
build zaccur the son of imri.

3:3 but the fish gate did the son of hassenaah build, who also laid
th beam thereof, and set up the door thereof, the lock thereof,
and the bar thereof.

3:4 and next unto them repair meremoth the son of urijah, the son of
koz. and next unto them repair meshullam the son of berechiah, the
son of meshezabeel. and next unto them repair zadok the son of
baana.

3:5 and next unto them the tekoit repaired; but their nobl put not
their neck to the work of their lord.

3:6 moreov the old gate repair jehoiada the son of paseah, and
meshullam the son of besodeiah; they laid the beam thereof, and set
up the door thereof, and the lock thereof, and the bar thereof.

3:7 and next unto them repair melatiah the gibeonite, and jadon the
meronothite, the men of gibeon, and of mizpah, unto the throne of the
governor on thi side the river.

3:8 next unto him repair uzziel the son of harhaiah, of the
goldsmiths.

next unto him also repair hananiah the son of one of the
apothecaries, and they fortifi jerusalem unto the broad wall.

3:9 and next unto them repair rephaiah the son of hur, the ruler of
th half part of jerusalem.

3:10 and next unto them repair jedaiah the son of harumaph, even
ov against hi house. and next unto him repair hattush the son of
hashabniah.

3:11 malchijah the son of harim, and hashub the son of pahathmoab,
repair the other piece, and the tower of the furnaces.

3:12 and next unto him repair shallum the son of halohesh, the ruler
of the half part of jerusalem, he and hi daughters.

3:13 the valley gate repair hanun, and the inhabit of zanoah;
they built it, and set up the door thereof, the lock thereof, and
th bar thereof, and a thousand cubit on the wall unto the dung
gate.

3:14 but the dung gate repair malchiah the son of rechab, the ruler
of part of bethhaccerem; he built it, and set up the door thereof,
th lock thereof, and the bar thereof.

3:15 but the gate of the fountain repair shallun the son of
colhozeh, the ruler of part of mizpah; he built it, and cover it,
and set up the door thereof, the lock thereof, and the bar thereof,
and the wall of the pool of siloah by the king' garden, and unto the
stair that go down from the citi of david.

3:16 after him repair nehemiah the son of azbuk, the ruler of the
half part of bethzur, unto the place over against the sepulchr of
david, and to the pool that wa made, and unto the hous of the
mighty.

3:17 after him repair the levites, rehum the son of bani. next unto
him repair hashabiah, the ruler of the half part of keilah, in his
part.

3:18 after him repair their brethren, bavai the son of henadad, the
rul of the half part of keilah.

3:19 and next to him repair ezer the son of jeshua, the ruler of
mizpah, anoth piec over against the go up to the armouri at the
turn of the wall.

3:20 after him baruch the son of zabbai earnestli repair the other
piece, from the turn of the wall unto the door of the hous of
eliashib the high priest.

3:21 after him repair meremoth the son of urijah the son of koz
anoth piece, from the door of the hous of eliashib even to the end
of the hous of eliashib.

3:22 and after him repair the priests, the men of the plain.

3:23 after him repair benjamin and hashub over against their house.

aft him repair azariah the son of maaseiah the son of ananiah by
hi house.

3:24 after him repair binnui the son of henadad anoth piece, from
th hous of azariah unto the turn of the wall, even unto the
corner.

3:25 palal the son of uzai, over against the turn of the wall, and
th tower which lieth out from the king' high house, that wa by the
court of the prison. after him pedaiah the son of parosh.

3:26 moreov the nethinim dwelt in ophel, unto the place over
against the water gate toward the east, and the tower that lieth out.

3:27 after them the tekoit repair anoth piece, over against the
great tower that lieth out, even unto the wall of ophel.

3:28 from abov the hors gate repair the priests, everi one over
against hi house.

3:29 after them repair zadok the son of immer over against his
house.

aft him repair also shemaiah the son of shechaniah, the keeper of
th east gate.

3:30 after him repair hananiah the son of shelemiah, and hanun the
sixth son of zalaph, anoth piece. after him repair meshullam the
son of berechiah over against hi chamber.

3:31 after him repair malchiah the goldsmith' son unto the place of
th nethinims, and of the merchants, over against the gate miphkad,
and to the go up of the corner.

3:32 and between the go up of the corner unto the sheep gate
repair the goldsmith and the merchants.

4:1 but it came to pass, that when sanballat heard that we build the
wall, he wa wroth, and took great indignation, and mock the jews.

4:2 and he spake befor hi brethren and the armi of samaria, and
said, what do these feebl jews? will they fortifi themselves? will
they sacrifice?  will they make an end in a day? will they reviv the
ston out of the heap of the rubbish which are burned?  4:3 now
tobiah the ammonit wa by him, and he said, even that which they
build, if a fox go up, he shall even break down their stone wall.

4:4 hear, O our god; for we are despised: and turn their reproach upon
their own head, and give them for a prey in the land of captivity: 4:5
and cover not their iniquity, and let not their sin be blot out
from befor thee: for they have provok thee to anger befor the
builders.

4:6 So built we the wall; and all the wall wa join togeth unto
th half thereof: for the peopl had a mind to work.

4:7 but it came to pass, that when sanballat, and tobiah, and the
arabians, and the ammonites, and the ashdodites, heard that the walls
of jerusalem were made up, and that the breach began to be stopped,
then they were veri wroth, 4:8 and conspir all of them togeth to
com and to fight against jerusalem, and to hinder it.

4:9 nevertheless we made our prayer unto our god, and set a watch
against them day and night, becaus of them.

4:10 and judah said, the strength of the bearer of burden is
decayed, and there is much rubbish; so that we are not abl to build
th wall.

4:11 and our adversari said, they shall not know, neither see, till
w come in the midst among them, and slay them, and caus the work to
cease.

4:12 and it came to pass, that when the jew which dwelt by them came,
they said unto us ten times, from all place whenc ye shall return
unto us they will be upon you.

4:13 therefor set I in the lower place behind the wall, and on the
high places, I even set the peopl after their famili with their
swords, their spears, and their bows.

4:14 and I looked, and rose up, and said unto the nobles, and to the
rulers, and to the rest of the people, Be not ye afraid of them:
rememb the lord, which is great and terrible, and fight for your
brethren, your sons, and your daughters, your wives, and your houses.

4:15 and it came to pass, when our enemi heard that it wa known
unto us, and god had brought their counsel to nought, that we returned
al of us to the wall, everi one unto hi work.

4:16 and it came to pass from that time forth, that the half of my
serv wrought in the work, and the other half of them held both the
spears, the shields, and the bows, and the habergeons; and the rulers
wer behind all the hous of judah.

4:17 they which build on the wall, and they that bare burdens, with
thos that laded, everi one with one of hi hand wrought in the work,
and with the other hand held a weapon.

4:18 for the builders, everi one had hi sword gird by hi side, and
so builded. and he that sound the trumpet wa by me.

4:19 and I said unto the nobles, and to the rulers, and to the rest of
th people, the work is great and large, and we are separ upon the
wall, one far from another.

4:20 In what place therefor ye hear the sound of the trumpet, resort
y thither unto us: our god shall fight for us.

4:21 So we labour in the work: and half of them held the spear from
th rise of the morn till the star appeared.

4:22 likewis at the same time said I unto the people, let everi one
with hi servant lodg within jerusalem, that in the night they may be
a guard to us, and labour on the day.

4:23 So neither I, nor my brethren, nor my servants, nor the men of
th guard which follow me, none of us put off our clothes, saving
that everi one put them off for washing.

5:1 and there wa a great cri of the peopl and of their wive against
their brethren the jews.

5:2 for there were that said, we, our sons, and our daughters, are
many: therefor we take up corn for them, that we may eat, and live.

5:3 some also there were that said, We have mortgag our lands,
vineyards, and houses, that we might buy corn, becaus of the dearth.

5:4 there were also that said, We have borrow money for the king's
tribute, and that upon our land and vineyards.

5:5 yet now our flesh is as the flesh of our brethren, our children as
their children: and, lo, we bring into bondag our son and our
daught to be servants, and some of our daughter are brought unto
bondag already: neither is it in our power to redeem them; for other
men have our land and vineyards.

5:6 and I wa veri angri when I heard their cri and these words.

5:7 then I consult with myself, and I rebuk the nobles, and the
rulers, and said unto them, Ye exact usury, everi one of hi brother.
and I set a great assembl against them.

5:8 and I said unto them, We after our abil have redeem our
brethren the jews, which were sold unto the heathen; and will ye even
sel your brethren? or shall they be sold unto us? then held they
their peace, and found noth to answer.

5:9 also I said, It is not good that ye do: ought ye not to walk in
th fear of our god becaus of the reproach of the heathen our
enemies?  5:10 I likewise, and my brethren, and my servants, might
exact of them money and corn: I pray you, let us leav off thi usury.

5:11 restore, I pray you, to them, even thi day, their lands, their
vineyards, their oliveyards, and their houses, also the hundredth part
of the money, and of the corn, the wine, and the oil, that ye exact of
them.

5:12 then said they, We will restor them, and will requir noth of
them; so will we do as thou sayest. then I call the priests, and
took an oath of them, that they should do accord to thi promise.

5:13 also I shook my lap, and said, So god shake out everi man from
hi house, and from hi labour, that performeth not thi promise, even
thu be he shaken out, and emptied. and all the congreg said,
amen, and prais the lord. and the peopl did accord to this
promise.

5:14 moreov from the time that I wa appoint to be their governor
in the land of judah, from the twentieth year even unto the two and
thirtieth year of artaxerx the king, that is, twelv years, I and my
brethren have not eaten the bread of the governor.

5:15 but the former governor that had been befor me were chargeable
unto the people, and had taken of them bread and wine, besid forty
shekel of silver; yea, even their servant bare rule over the people:
but so did not I, becaus of the fear of god.

5:16 yea, also I continu in the work of thi wall, neither bought we
ani land: and all my servant were gather thither unto the work.

5:17 moreov there were at my tabl an hundr and fifti of the jews
and rulers, besid those that came unto us from among the heathen that
ar about us.

5:18 now that which wa prepar for me daili wa one ox and six
choic sheep; also fowl were prepar for me, and onc in ten days
stor of all sort of wine: yet for all thi requir not I the bread
of the governor, becaus the bondag wa heavi upon thi people.

5:19 think upon me, my god, for good, accord to all that I have
don for thi people.

6:1 now it came to pass when sanballat, and tobiah, and geshem the
arabian, and the rest of our enemies, heard that I had build the
wall, and that there wa no breach left therein; (though at that time
i had not set up the door upon the gates;) 6:2 that sanballat and
geshem sent unto me, saying, come, let us meet togeth in some one of
th villag in the plain of ono. but they thought to do me mischief.

6:3 and I sent messeng unto them, saying, I am do a great work,
so that I cannot come down: whi should the work cease, whilst I leave
it, and come down to you?  6:4 yet they sent unto me four time after
thi sort; and I answer them after the same manner.

6:5 then sent sanballat hi servant unto me in like manner the fifth
tim with an open letter in hi hand; 6:6 wherein wa written, It is
report among the heathen, and gashmu saith it, that thou and the
jew think to rebel: for which caus thou buildest the wall, that thou
mayest be their king, accord to these words.

6:7 and thou hast also appoint prophet to preach of thee at
jerusalem, saying, there is a king in judah: and now shall it be
report to the king accord to these words. come now therefore, and
let us take counsel together.

6:8 then I sent unto him, saying, there are no such thing done as
thou sayest, but thou feignest them out of thine own heart.

6:9 for they all made us afraid, saying, their hand shall be weakened
from the work, that it be not done. now therefore, O god, strengthen
mi hands.

6:10 afterward I came unto the hous of shemaiah the son of delaiah
th son of mehetabeel, who wa shut up; and he said, let us meet
togeth in the hous of god, within the temple, and let us shut the
door of the temple: for they will come to slay thee; yea, in the
night will they come to slay thee.

6:11 and I said, should such a man as I flee? and who is there, that,
b as I am, would go into the templ to save hi life? I will not
go in.

6:12 and, lo, I perceiv that god had not sent him; but that he
pronounc thi propheci against me: for tobiah and sanballat had
hir him.

6:13 therefor wa he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and
sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they
might reproach me.

6:14 My god, think thou upon tobiah and sanballat accord to these
their works, and on the prophetess noadiah, and the rest of the
prophets, that would have put me in fear.

6:15 So the wall wa finish in the twenti and fifth day of the month
elul, in fifti and two days.

6:16 and it came to pass, that when all our enemi heard thereof, and
al the heathen that were about us saw these things, they were much
cast down in their own eyes: for they perceiv that thi work was
wrought of our god.

6:17 moreov in those day the nobl of judah sent mani letter unto
tobiah, and the letter of tobiah came unto them.

6:18 for there were mani in judah sworn unto him, becaus he wa the
son in law of shechaniah the son of arah; and hi son johanan had
taken the daughter of meshullam the son of berechiah.

6:19 also they report hi good deed befor me, and utter my words
to him. and tobiah sent letter to put me in fear.

7:1 now it came to pass, when the wall wa built, and I had set up the
doors, and the porter and the singer and the levit were appointed,
7:2 that I gave my brother hanani, and hananiah the ruler of the
