palace, charg over jerusalem: for he wa a faith man, and feared
god abov many.

7:3 and I said unto them, let not the gate of jerusalem be opened
until the sun be hot; and while they stand by, let them shut the
doors, and bar them: and appoint watch of the inhabit of
jerusalem, everi one in hi watch, and everi one to be over against
hi house.

7:4 now the citi wa larg and great: but the peopl were few therein,
and the hous were not builded.

7:5 and my god put into mine heart to gather togeth the nobles, and
th rulers, and the people, that they might be reckon by genealogy.
and I found a regist of the genealog of them which came up at the
first, and found written therein, 7:6 these are the children of the
province, that went up out of the captivity, of those that had been
carri away, whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carried
away, and came again to jerusalem and to judah, everi one unto his
city; 7:7 who came with zerubbabel, jeshua, nehemiah, azariah,
raamiah, nahamani, mordecai, bilshan, mispereth, bigvai, nehum,
baanah. the number, I say, of the men of the peopl of israel was
this; 7:8 the children of parosh, two thousand an hundr seventi and
two.

7:9 the children of shephatiah, three hundr seventi and two.

7:10 the children of arah, six hundr fifti and two.

7:11 the children of pahathmoab, of the children of jeshua and joab,
two thousand and eight hundr and eighteen.

7:12 the children of elam, a thousand two hundr fifti and four.

7:13 the children of zattu, eight hundr forti and five.

7:14 the children of zaccai, seven hundr and threescore.

7:15 the children of binnui, six hundr forti and eight.

7:16 the children of bebai, six hundr twenti and eight.

7:17 the children of azgad, two thousand three hundr twenti and two.

7:18 the children of adonikam, six hundr threescor and seven.

7:19 the children of bigvai, two thousand threescor and seven.

7:20 the children of adin, six hundr fifti and five.

7:21 the children of ater of hezekiah, nineti and eight.

7:22 the children of hashum, three hundr twenti and eight.

7:23 the children of bezai, three hundr twenti and four.

7:24 the children of hariph, an hundr and twelve.

7:25 the children of gibeon, nineti and five.

7:26 the men of bethlehem and netophah, an hundr fourscor and
eight.

7:27 the men of anathoth, an hundr twenti and eight.

7:28 the men of bethazmaveth, forti and two.

7:29 the men of kirjathjearim, chephirah, and beeroth, seven hundred
forti and three.

7:30 the men of ramah and gaba, six hundr twenti and one.

7:31 the men of michmas, an hundr and twenti and two.

7:32 the men of bethel and ai, an hundr twenti and three.

7:33 the men of the other nebo, fifti and two.

7:34 the children of the other elam, a thousand two hundr fifti and
four.

7:35 the children of harim, three hundr and twenty.

7:36 the children of jericho, three hundr forti and five.

7:37 the children of lod, hadid, and ono, seven hundr twenti and
one.

7:38 the children of senaah, three thousand nine hundr and thirty.

7:39 the priests: the children of jedaiah, of the hous of jeshua,
nin hundr seventi and three.

7:40 the children of immer, a thousand fifti and two.

7:41 the children of pashur, a thousand two hundr forti and seven.

7:42 the children of harim, a thousand and seventeen.

7:43 the levites: the children of jeshua, of kadmiel, and of the
children of hodevah, seventi and four.

7:44 the singers: the children of asaph, an hundr forti and eight.

7:45 the porters: the children of shallum, the children of ater, the
children of talmon, the children of akkub, the children of hatita, the
children of shobai, an hundr thirti and eight.

7:46 the nethinims: the children of ziha, the children of hashupha,
th children of tabbaoth, 7:47 the children of keros, the children of
sia, the children of padon, 7:48 the children of lebana, the children
of hagaba, the children of shalmai, 7:49 the children of hanan, the
children of giddel, the children of gahar, 7:50 the children of
reaiah, the children of rezin, the children of nekoda, 7:51 the
children of gazzam, the children of uzza, the children of phaseah,
7:52 the children of besai, the children of meunim, the children of
nephishesim, 7:53 the children of bakbuk, the children of hakupha, the
children of harhur, 7:54 the children of bazlith, the children of
mehida, the children of harsha, 7:55 the children of barkos, the
children of sisera, the children of tamah, 7:56 the children of
neziah, the children of hatipha.

7:57 the children of solomon' servants: the children of sotai, the
children of sophereth, the children of perida, 7:58 the children of
jaala, the children of darkon, the children of giddel, 7:59 the
children of shephatiah, the children of hattil, the children of
pochereth of zebaim, the children of amon.

7:60 all the nethinims, and the children of solomon' servants, were
thre hundr nineti and two.

7:61 and these were they which went up also from telmelah, telharesha,
cherub, addon, and immer: but they could not shew their father's
house, nor their seed, whether they were of israel.

7:62 the children of delaiah, the children of tobiah, the children of
nekoda, six hundr forti and two.

7:63 and of the priests: the children of habaiah, the children of koz,
th children of barzillai, which took one of the daughter of
barzillai the gileadit to wife, and wa call after their name.

7:64 these sought their regist among those that were reckon by
genealogy, but it wa not found: therefor were they, as polluted, put
from the priesthood.

7:65 and the tirshatha said unto them, that they should not eat of the
most holi things, till there stood up a priest with urim and thummim.

7:66 the whole congreg togeth wa forti and two thousand three
hundr and threescore, 7:67 besid their manserv and their
maidservants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundr thirty
and seven: and they had two hundr forti and five sing men and
sing women.

7:68 their horses, seven hundr thirti and six: their mules, two
hundr forti and five: 7:69 their camels, four hundr thirti and
five: six thousand seven hundr and twenti asses.

7:70 and some of the chief of the father gave unto the work. the
tirshatha gave to the treasur a thousand dram of gold, fifti basons,
f hundr and thirti priests' garments.

7:71 and some of the chief of the father gave to the treasur of the
work twenti thousand dram of gold, and two thousand and two hundred
pound of silver.

7:72 and that which the rest of the peopl gave wa twenti thousand
dram of gold, and two thousand pound of silver, and threescor and
seven priests' garments.

7:73 So the priests, and the levites, and the porters, and the
singers, and some of the people, and the nethinims, and all israel,
dwelt in their cities; and when the seventh month came, the children
of israel were in their cities.

8:1 and all the peopl gather themselv togeth as one man into
th street that wa befor the water gate; and they spake unto ezra
th scribe to bring the book of the law of moses, which the lord had
command to israel.

8:2 and ezra the priest brought the law befor the congreg both
of men and women, and all that could hear with understanding, upon the
first day of the seventh month.

8:3 and he read therein befor the street that wa befor the water
g from the morn until midday, befor the men and the women, and
thos that could understand; and the ear of all the peopl were
attent unto the book of the law.

8:4 and ezra the scribe stood upon a pulpit of wood, which they had
mad for the purpose; and besid him stood mattithiah, and shema, and
anaiah, and urijah, and hilkiah, and maaseiah, on hi right hand; and
on hi left hand, pedaiah, and mishael, and malchiah, and hashum, and
hashbadana, zechariah, and meshullam.

8:5 and ezra open the book in the sight of all the people; (for he
wa abov all the people;) and when he open it, all the peopl stood
up: 8:6 and ezra bless the lord, the great god. and all the people
answered, amen, amen, with lift up their hands: and they bowed
their heads, and worship the lord with their face to the ground.

8:7 also jeshua, and bani, and sherebiah, jamin, akkub, shabbethai,
hodijah, maaseiah, kelita, azariah, jozabad, hanan, pelaiah, and the
levites, caus the peopl to understand the law: and the peopl stood
in their place.

8:8 So they read in the book in the law of god distinctly, and gave
th sense, and caus them to understand the reading.

8:9 and nehemiah, which is the tirshatha, and ezra the priest the
scribe, and the levit that taught the people, said unto all the
people, thi day is holi unto the lord your god; mourn not, nor weep.
for all the peopl wept, when they heard the word of the law.

8:10 then he said unto them, Go your way, eat the fat, and drink the
sweet, and send portion unto them for whom noth is prepared: for
thi day is holi unto our lord: neither be ye sorry; for the joy of
th lord is your strength.

8:11 So the levit still all the people, saying, hold your peace,
for the day is holy; neither be ye grieved.

8:12 and all the peopl went their way to eat, and to drink, and to
send portions, and to make great mirth, becaus they had understood
th word that were declar unto them.

8:13 and on the second day were gather togeth the chief of the
fath of all the people, the priests, and the levites, unto ezra the
scribe, even to understand the word of the law.

8:14 and they found written in the law which the lord had command by
moses, that the children of israel should dwell in booth in the feast
of the seventh month: 8:15 and that they should publish and proclaim
in all their cities, and in jerusalem, saying, Go forth unto the
mount, and fetch oliv branches, and pine branches, and myrtle
branches, and palm branches, and branch of thick trees, to make
booths, as it is written.

8:16 So the peopl went forth, and brought them, and made themselves
booths, everi one upon the roof of hi house, and in their courts, and
in the court of the hous of god, and in the street of the water
gate, and in the street of the gate of ephraim.

8:17 and all the congreg of them that were come again out of the
capt made booths, and sat under the booths: for sinc the day of
jeshua the son of nun unto that day had not the children of israel
don so. and there wa veri great gladness.

8:18 also day by day, from the first day unto the last day, he read in
th book of the law of god. and they kept the feast seven days; and on
th eighth day wa a solemn assembly, accord unto the manner.

9:1 now in the twenti and fourth day of thi month the children of
israel were assembl with fasting, and with sackclothes, and earth
upon them.

9:2 and the seed of israel separ themselv from all strangers,
and stood and confess their sins, and the iniqu of their
fathers.

9:3 and they stood up in their place, and read in the book of the law
of the lord their god one fourth part of the day; and anoth fourth
part they confessed, and worship the lord their god.

9:4 then stood up upon the stairs, of the levites, jeshua, and bani,
kadmiel, shebaniah, bunni, sherebiah, bani, and chenani, and cried
with a loud voic unto the lord their god.

9:5 then the levites, jeshua, and kadmiel, bani, hashabniah,
sherebiah, hodijah, shebaniah, and pethahiah, said, stand up and bless
th lord your god for ever and ever: and bless be thi gloriou name,
which is exalt abov all bless and praise.

9:6 thou, even thou, art lord alone; thou hast made heaven, the heaven
of heavens, with all their host, the earth, and all thing that are
therein, the seas, and all that is therein, and thou preservest them
all; and the host of heaven worshippeth thee.

9:7 thou art the lord the god, who didst choos abram, and broughtest
him forth out of Ur of the chaldees, and gavest him the name of
abraham; 9:8 and foundest hi heart faith befor thee, and madest a
coven with him to give the land of the canaanites, the hittites,
th amorites, and the perizzites, and the jebusites, and the
girgashites, to give it, I say, to hi seed, and hast perform thy
words; for thou art righteous: 9:9 and didst see the afflict of our
fath in egypt, and heardest their cri by the red sea; 9:10 and
shewedst sign and wonder upon pharaoh, and on all hi servants, and
on all the peopl of hi land: for thou knewest that they dealt
proudli against them. So didst thou get thee a name, as it is this
day.

9:11 and thou didst divid the sea befor them, so that they went
through the midst of the sea on the dri land; and their persecutors
th threwest into the deeps, as a stone into the mighti waters.

9:12 moreov thou leddest them in the day by a cloudi pillar; and in
th night by a pillar of fire, to give them light in the way wherein
they should go.

9:13 thou camest down also upon mount sinai, and spakest with them
from heaven, and gavest them right judgments, and true laws, good
statut and commandments: 9:14 and madest known unto them thi holy
sabbath, and commandedst them precepts, statutes, and laws, by the
hand of mose thi servant: 9:15 and gavest them bread from heaven for
their hunger, and broughtest forth water for them out of the rock for
their thirst, and promisedst them that they should go in to possess
th land which thou hadst sworn to give them.

9:16 but they and our father dealt proudly, and harden their necks,
and hearken not to thi commandments, 9:17 and refus to obey,
neith were mind of thi wonder that thou didst among them; but
harden their necks, and in their rebellion appoint a captain to
return to their bondage: but thou art a god readi to pardon, gracious
and merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and forsookest
them not.

9:18 yea, when they had made them a molten calf, and said, thi is thy
god that brought thee up out of egypt, and had wrought great
provocations; 9:19 yet thou in thi manifold merci forsookest them
not in the wilderness: the pillar of the cloud depart not from them
bi day, to lead them in the way; neither the pillar of fire by night,
to shew them light, and the way wherein they should go.

9:20 thou gavest also thi good spirit to instruct them, and
withheldest not thi manna from their mouth, and gavest them water for
their thirst.

9:21 yea, forti year didst thou sustain them in the wilderness, so
that they lack nothing; their cloth wax not old, and their feet
swel not.

9:22 moreov thou gavest them kingdom and nations, and didst divide
them into corners: so they possess the land of sihon, and the land
of the king of heshbon, and the land of Og king of bashan.

9:23 their children also multipliedst thou as the star of heaven, and
broughtest them into the land, concern which thou hadst promis to
their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.

9:24 So the children went in and possess the land, and thou
subduedst befor them the inhabit of the land, the canaanites, and
gavest them into their hands, with their kings, and the peopl of the
land, that they might do with them as they would.

9:25 and they took strong cities, and a fat land, and possess houses
ful of all goods, well digged, vineyards, and oliveyards, and fruit
tre in abundance: so they did eat, and were filled, and becam fat,
and delight themselv in thi great goodness.

9:26 nevertheless they were disobedient, and rebel against thee,
and cast thi law behind their backs, and slew thi prophet which
testifi against them to turn them to thee, and they wrought great
provocations.

9:27 therefor thou deliveredst them into the hand of their enemies,
who vex them: and in the time of their trouble, when they cri unto
thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and accord to thi manifold
merci thou gavest them saviours, who save them out of the hand of
their enemies.

9:28 but after they had rest, they did evil again befor thee:
therefor leftest thou them in the land of their enemies, so that they
had the dominion over them: yet when they returned, and cri unto
thee, thou heardest them from heaven; and mani time didst thou
deliv them accord to thi mercies; 9:29 and testifiedst against
them, that thou mightest bring them again unto thi law: yet they dealt
proudly, and hearken not unto thi commandments, but sin against
thi judgments, (which if a man do, he shall live in them;) and
withdrew the shoulder, and harden their neck, and would not hear.

9:30 yet mani year didst thou forbear them, and testifiedst against
them by thi spirit in thi prophets: yet would they not give ear:
therefor gavest thou them into the hand of the peopl of the lands.

9:31 nevertheless for thi great mercies' sake thou didst not utterly
consum them, nor forsak them; for thou art a graciou and merciful
god.

9:32 now therefore, our god, the great, the mighty, and the terrible
god, who keepest coven and mercy, let not all the troubl seem
littl befor thee, that hath come upon us, on our kings, on our
princes, and on our priests, and on our prophets, and on our fathers,
and on all thi people, sinc the time of the king of assyria unto
thi day.

9:33 howbeit thou art just in all that is brought upon us; for thou
hast done right, but we have done wickedly: 9:34 neither have our
kings, our princes, our priests, nor our fathers, kept thi law, nor
hearken unto thi command and thi testimonies, wherewith thou
didst testifi against them.

9:35 for they have not serv thee in their kingdom, and in thi great
good that thou gavest them, and in the larg and fat land which
thou gavest befor them, neither turn they from their wick works.

9:36 behold, we are servant thi day, and for the land that thou
gavest unto our father to eat the fruit thereof and the good thereof,
behold, we are servant in it: 9:37 and it yieldeth much increas unto
th king whom thou hast set over us becaus of our sins: also they
hav dominion over our bodies, and over our cattle, at their pleasure,
and we are in great distress.

9:38 and becaus of all thi we make a sure covenant, and write it;
and our princes, levites, and priests, seal unto it.

10:1 now those that seal were, nehemiah, the tirshatha, the son of
hachaliah, and zidkijah, 10:2 seraiah, azariah, jeremiah, 10:3 pashur,
amariah, malchijah, 10:4 hattush, shebaniah, malluch, 10:5 harim,
meremoth, obadiah, 10:6 daniel, ginnethon, baruch, 10:7 meshullam,
abijah, mijamin, 10:8 maaziah, bilgai, shemaiah: these were the
priests.

10:9 and the levites: both jeshua the son of azaniah, binnui of the
son of henadad, kadmiel; 10:10 and their brethren, shebaniah,
hodijah, kelita, pelaiah, hanan, 10:11 micha, rehob, hashabiah, 10:12
zaccur, sherebiah, shebaniah, 10:13 hodijah, bani, beninu.

10:14 the chief of the people; parosh, pahathmoab, elam, zatthu, bani,
10:15 bunni, azgad, bebai, 10:16 adonijah, bigvai, adin, 10:17 ater,
hizkijah, azzur, 10:18 hodijah, hashum, bezai, 10:19 hariph, anathoth,
nebai, 10:20 magpiash, meshullam, hezir, 10:21 meshezabeel, zadok,
jaddua, 10:22 pelatiah, hanan, anaiah, 10:23 hoshea, hananiah, hashub,
10:24 hallohesh, pileha, shobek, 10:25 rehum, hashabnah, maaseiah,
10:26 and ahijah, hanan, anan, 10:27 malluch, harim, baanah.

10:28 and the rest of the people, the priests, the levites, the
porters, the singers, the nethinims, and all they that had separated
themselv from the peopl of the land unto the law of god, their
wives, their sons, and their daughters, everi one have knowledge,
and have understanding; 10:29 they clave to their brethren, their
nobles, and enter into a curse, and into an oath, to walk in god's
law, which wa given by mose the servant of god, and to observ and
do all the command of the lord our lord, and hi judgment and
hi statutes; 10:30 and that we would not give our daughter unto the
peopl of the land, not take their daughter for our sons: 10:31 and
if the peopl of the land bring ware or ani victual on the sabbath
day to sell, that we would not buy it of them on the sabbath, or on
th holi day: and that we would leav the seventh year, and the
exact of everi debt.

10:32 also we made ordin for us, to charg ourselv yearli with
th third part of a shekel for the servic of the hous of our god;
10:33 for the shewbread, and for the continu meat offering, and for
th continu burnt offering, of the sabbaths, of the new moons, for
th set feasts, and for the holi things, and for the sin offer to
mak an aton for israel, and for all the work of the hous of our
god.

10:34 and we cast the lot among the priests, the levites, and the
people, for the wood offering, to bring it into the hous of our god,
aft the hous of our fathers, at time appoint year by year, to
burn upon the altar of the lord our god, as it is written in the law:
10:35 and to bring the firstfruit of our ground, and the firstfruits
of all fruit of all trees, year by year, unto the hous of the lord:
10:36 also the firstborn of our sons, and of our cattle, as it is
written in the law, and the firstl of our herd and of our flocks,
to bring to the hous of our god, unto the priest that minist in
th hous of our god: 10:37 and that we should bring the firstfruits
of our dough, and our offerings, and the fruit of all manner of trees,
of wine and of oil, unto the priests, to the chamber of the hous of
our god; and the tith of our ground unto the levites, that the same
levit might have the tith in all the citi of our tillage.

10:38 and the priest the son of aaron shall be with the levites, when
th levit take tithes: and the levit shall bring up the tith of
th tith unto the hous of our god, to the chambers, into the
treasur house.

10:39 for the children of israel and the children of levi shall bring
th offer of the corn, of the new wine, and the oil, unto the
chambers, where are the vessel of the sanctuary, and the priest that
minister, and the porters, and the singers: and we will not forsake
th hous of our god.

11:1 and the ruler of the peopl dwelt at jerusalem: the rest of the
peopl also cast lots, to bring one of ten to dwell in jerusalem the
holi city, and nine part to dwell in other cities.

11:2 and the peopl bless all the men, that willingli offered
themselv to dwell at jerusalem.

11:3 now these are the chief of the provinc that dwelt in jerusalem:
but in the citi of judah dwelt everi one in hi possess in their
cities, to wit, israel, the priests, and the levites, and the
nethinims, and the children of solomon' servants.

11:4 and at jerusalem dwelt certain of the children of judah, and of
th children of benjamin. Of the children of judah; athaiah the son of
uzziah, the son of zechariah, the son of amariah, the son of
shephatiah, the son of mahalaleel, of the children of perez; 11:5 and
maaseiah the son of baruch, the son of colhozeh, the son of hazaiah,
th son of adaiah, the son of joiarib, the son of zechariah, the son
of shiloni.

11:6 all the son of perez that dwelt at jerusalem were four hundred
threescor and eight valiant men.

11:7 and these are the son of benjamin; sallu the son of meshullam,
th son of joed, the son of pedaiah, the son of kolaiah, the son of
maaseiah, the son of ithiel, the son of jesaiah.

11:8 and after him gabbai, sallai, nine hundr twenti and eight.

11:9 and joel the son of zichri wa their overseer: and judah the son
of senuah wa second over the city.

11:10 Of the priests: jedaiah the son of joiarib, jachin.

11:11 seraiah the son of hilkiah, the son of meshullam, the son of
zadok, the son of meraioth, the son of ahitub, wa the ruler of the
hous of god.

11:12 and their brethren that did the work of the hous were eight
hundr twenti and two: and adaiah the son of jeroham, the son of
pelaliah, the son of amzi, the son of zechariah, the son of pashur,
th son of malchiah.

11:13 and hi brethren, chief of the fathers, two hundr forti and
two: and amashai the son of azareel, the son of ahasai, the son of
meshillemoth, the son of immer, 11:14 and their brethren, mighti men
of valour, an hundr twenti and eight: and their overs was
zabdiel, the son of one of the great men.

11:15 also of the levites: shemaiah the son of hashub, the son of
azrikam, the son of hashabiah, the son of bunni; 11:16 and shabbethai
and jozabad, of the chief of the levites, had the oversight of the
outward busi of the hous of god.

11:17 and mattaniah the son of micha, the son of zabdi, the son of
asaph, wa the princip to begin the thanksgiv in prayer: and
bakbukiah the second among hi brethren, and abda the son of shammua,
th son of galal, the son of jeduthun.

11:18 all the levit in the holi citi were two hundr fourscor and
four.

11:19 moreov the porters, akkub, talmon, and their brethren that
kept the gates, were an hundr seventi and two.

11:20 and the residu of israel, of the priests, and the levites, were
in all the citi of judah, everi one in hi inheritance.

11:21 but the nethinim dwelt in ophel: and ziha and gispa were over
th nethinims.

11:22 the overs also of the levit at jerusalem wa uzzi the son
of bani, the son of hashabiah, the son of mattaniah, the son of micha.
of the son of asaph, the singer were over the busi of the house
of god.

11:23 for it wa the king' command concern them, that a
certain portion should be for the singers, due for everi day.

11:24 and pethahiah the son of meshezabeel, of the children of zerah
th son of judah, wa at the king' hand in all matter concern the
people.

11:25 and for the villages, with their fields, some of the children of
judah dwelt at kirjatharba, and in the villag thereof, and at dibon,
and in the villag thereof, and at jekabzeel, and in the villages
thereof, 11:26 and at jeshua, and at moladah, and at bethphelet, 11:27
and at hazarshual, and at beersheba, and in the villag thereof,
11:28 and at ziklag, and at mekonah, and in the villag thereof,
11:29 and at enrimmon, and at zareah, and at jarmuth, 11:30 zanoah,
adullam, and in their villages, at lachish, and the field thereof, at
azekah, and in the villag thereof. and they dwelt from beersheba
unto the valley of hinnom.

11:31 the children also of benjamin from geba dwelt at michmash, and
aija, and bethel, and in their villages.

11:32 and at anathoth, nob, ananiah, 11:33 hazor, ramah, gittaim,
11:34 hadid, zeboim, neballat, 11:35 lod, and ono, the valley of
craftsmen.

11:36 and of the levit were divis in judah, and in benjamin.

12:1 now these are the priest and the levit that went up with
zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, and jeshua: seraiah, jeremiah, ezra,
12:2 amariah, malluch, hattush, 12:3 shechaniah, rehum, meremoth, 12:4
iddo, ginnetho, abijah, 12:5 miamin, maadiah, bilgah, 12:6 shemaiah,
and joiarib, jedaiah, 12:7 sallu, amok, hilkiah, jedaiah. these were
th chief of the priest and of their brethren in the day of jeshua.

12:8 moreov the levites: jeshua, binnui, kadmiel, sherebiah, judah,
and mattaniah, which wa over the thanksgiving, he and hi brethren.

12:9 also bakbukiah and unni, their brethren, were over against them
in the watches.

12:10 and jeshua begat joiakim, joiakim also begat eliashib, and
eliashib begat joiada, 12:11 and joiada begat jonathan, and jonathan
begat jaddua.

12:12 and in the day of joiakim were priests, the chief of the
fathers: of seraiah, meraiah; of jeremiah, hananiah; 12:13 Of ezra,
meshullam; of amariah, jehohanan; 12:14 Of melicu, jonathan; of
shebaniah, joseph; 12:15 Of harim, adna; of meraioth, helkai; 12:16 of
iddo, zechariah; of ginnethon, meshullam; 12:17 Of abijah, zichri; of
miniamin, of moadiah, piltai: 12:18 Of bilgah, shammua; of shemaiah,
jehonathan; 12:19 and of joiarib, mattenai; of jedaiah, uzzi; 12:20 of
sallai, kallai; of amok, eber; 12:21 Of hilkiah, hashabiah; of
jedaiah, nethaneel.

12:22 the levit in the day of eliashib, joiada, and johanan, and
jaddua, were record chief of the fathers: also the priests, to the
reign of dariu the persian.

12:23 the son of levi, the chief of the fathers, were written in the
book of the chronicles, even until the day of johanan the son of
eliashib.

12:24 and the chief of the levites: hashabiah, sherebiah, and jeshua
th son of kadmiel, with their brethren over against them, to praise
and to give thanks, accord to the command of david the man of
god, ward over against ward.

12:25 mattaniah, and bakbukiah, obadiah, meshullam, talmon, akkub,
wer porter keep the ward at the threshold of the gates.

12:26 these were in the day of joiakim the son of jeshua, the son of
jozadak, and in the day of nehemiah the governor, and of ezra the
priest, the scribe.

12:27 and at the dedic of the wall of jerusalem they sought the
levit out of all their places, to bring them to jerusalem, to keep
th dedic with gladness, both with thanksgivings, and with
singing, with cymbals, psalteries, and with harps.

12:28 and the son of the singer gather themselv together, both
out of the plain countri round about jerusalem, and from the villages
of netophathi; 12:29 also from the hous of gilgal, and out of the
field of geba and azmaveth: for the singer had build them villages
round about jerusalem.

12:30 and the priest and the levit purifi themselves, and
purifi the people, and the gates, and the wall.

12:31 then I brought up the princ of judah upon the wall, and
appoint two great compani of them that gave thanks, whereof one
w on the right hand upon the wall toward the dung gate: 12:32 and
aft them went hoshaiah, and half of the princ of judah, 12:33 and
azariah, ezra, and meshullam, 12:34 judah, and benjamin, and shemaiah,
and jeremiah, 12:35 and certain of the priests' son with trumpets;
namely, zechariah the son of jonathan, the son of shemaiah, the son of
mattaniah, the son of michaiah, the son of zaccur, the son of asaph:
12:36 and hi brethren, shemaiah, and azarael, milalai, gilalai, maai,
nethaneel, and judah, hanani, with the music instrument of david
th man of god, and ezra the scribe befor them.

12:37 and at the fountain gate, which wa over against them, they went
up by the stair of the citi of david, at the go up of the wall,
abov the hous of david, even unto the water gate eastward.

12:38 and the other compani of them that gave thank went over against
them, and I after them, and the half of the peopl upon the wall, from
beyond the tower of the furnac even unto the broad wall; 12:39 and
from abov the gate of ephraim, and abov the old gate, and abov the
fish gate, and the tower of hananeel, and the tower of meah, even unto
th sheep gate: and they stood still in the prison gate.

12:40 So stood the two compani of them that gave thank in the house
of god, and I, and the half of the ruler with me: 12:41 and the
priests; eliakim, maaseiah, miniamin, michaiah, elioenai, zechariah,
and hananiah, with trumpets; 12:42 and maaseiah, and shemaiah, and
eleazar, and uzzi, and jehohanan, and malchijah, and elam, and ezer.
and the singer sang loud, with jezrahiah their overseer.

12:43 also that day they offer great sacrifices, and rejoiced: for
god had made them rejoic with great joy: the wive also and the
children rejoiced: so that the joy of jerusalem wa heard even afar
off.

12:44 and at that time were some appoint over the chamber for the
treasures, for the offerings, for the firstfruits, and for the tithes,
to gather into them out of the field of the citi the portion of
th law for the priest and levites: for judah rejoic for the
priest and for the levit that waited.

12:45 and both the singer and the porter kept the ward of their god,
and the ward of the purification, accord to the command of
david, and of solomon hi son.

12:46 for in the day of david and asaph of old there were chief of
th singers, and song of prais and thanksgiv unto god.

12:47 and all israel in the day of zerubbabel, and in the day of
nehemiah, gave the portion of the singer and the porters, everi day
hi portion: and they sanctifi holi thing unto the levites; and the
levit sanctifi them unto the children of aaron.

13:1 On that day they read in the book of mose in the audienc of the
people; and therein wa found written, that the ammonit and the
moabit should not come into the congreg of god for ever; 13:2
becaus they met not the children of israel with bread and with water,
but hire balaam against them, that he should curs them: howbeit our
god turn the curs into a blessing.

13:3 now it came to pass, when they had heard the law, that they
separ from israel all the mix multitude.

13:4 and befor this, eliashib the priest, have the oversight of the
chamb of the hous of our god, wa alli unto tobiah: 13:5 and he
had prepar for him a great chamber, where aforetim they laid the
meat offerings, the frankincense, and the vessels, and the tith of
th corn, the new wine, and the oil, which wa command to be given
to the levites, and the singers, and the porters; and the offer of
th priests.

13:6 but in all thi time wa not I at jerusalem: for in the two and
thirtieth year of artaxerx king of babylon came I unto the king, and
aft certain day obtain I leav of the king: 13:7 and I came to
jerusalem, and understood of the evil that eliashib did for tobiah, in
prepar him a chamber in the court of the hous of god.

13:8 and it griev me sore: therefor I cast forth all the household
stuff to tobiah out of the chamber.

13:9 then I commanded, and they cleans the chambers: and thither
brought I again the vessel of the hous of god, with the meat
off and the frankincense.

13:10 and I perceiv that the portion of the levit had not been
given them: for the levit and the singers, that did the work, were
fl everi one to hi field.

13:11 then contend I with the rulers, and said, whi is the hous of
god forsaken? and I gather them together, and set them in their
place.

13:12 then brought all judah the tith of the corn and the new wine
and the oil unto the treasuries.

13:13 and I made treasur over the treasuries, shelemiah the priest,
and zadok the scribe, and of the levites, pedaiah: and next to them
wa hanan the son of zaccur, the son of mattaniah: for they were
count faithful, and their offic wa to distribut unto their
brethren.

13:14 rememb me, O my god, concern this, and wipe not out my good
de that I have done for the hous of my god, and for the offices
thereof.

13:15 In those day saw I in judah some tread wine press on the
sabbath, and bring in sheaves, and lade asses; as also wine,
grapes, and figs, and all manner of burdens, which they brought into
jerusalem on the sabbath day: and I testifi against them in the day
wherein they sold victuals.

13:16 there dwelt men of tyre also therein, which brought fish, and
al manner of ware, and sold on the sabbath unto the children of
judah, and in jerusalem.

13:17 then I contend with the nobl of judah, and said unto them,
what evil thing is thi that ye do, and profan the sabbath day?
13:18 did not your father thus, and did not our god bring all this
evil upon us, and upon thi city? yet ye bring more wrath upon israel
bi profan the sabbath.

13:19 and it came to pass, that when the gate of jerusalem began to
b dark befor the sabbath, I command that the gate should be shut,
and charg that they should not be open till after the sabbath: and
som of my servant set I at the gates, that there should no burden be
brought in on the sabbath day.

13:20 So the merchant and seller of all kind of ware lodg without
jerusalem onc or twice.

13:21 then I testifi against them, and said unto them, whi lodg ye
about the wall? if ye do so again, I will lay hand on you. from that
tim forth came they no more on the sabbath.

13:22 and I command the levit that they should cleans themselves,
and that they should come and keep the gates, to sanctifi the sabbath
day.

rememb me, O my god, concern thi also, and spare me accord to
th great of thi mercy.

13:23 In those day also saw I jew that had marri wive of ashdod,
of ammon, and of moab: 13:24 and their children spake half in the
speech of ashdod, and could not speak in the jews' language, but
accord to the languag of each people.

13:25 and I contend with them, and curs them, and smote certain of
them, and pluck off their hair, and made them swear by god, saying,
y shall not give your daughter unto their sons, nor take their
daught unto your sons, or for yourselves.

13:26 did not solomon king of israel sin by these things? yet among
mani nation wa there no king like him, who wa belov of hi god,
and god made him king over all israel: nevertheless even him did
outlandish women caus to sin.

13:27 shall we then hearken unto you to do all thi great evil, to
transgress against our god in marri strang wives?  13:28 and one
of the son of joiada, the son of eliashib the high priest, wa son in
law to sanballat the horonite: therefor I chase him from me.

13:29 rememb them, O my god, becaus they have defil the
priesthood, and the coven of the priesthood, and of the levites.

13:30 thu cleans I them from all strangers, and appoint the wards
of the priest and the levites, everi one in hi business; 13:31 and
for the wood offering, at time appointed, and for the firstfruits.
rememb me, O my god, for good.




th book of esther


1:1 now it came to pass in the day of ahasuerus, (thi is ahasuerus
which reigned, from india even unto ethiopia, over an hundr and
seven and twenti provinces:) 1:2 that in those days, when the king
ahasueru sat on the throne of hi kingdom, which wa in shushan the
palace, 1:3 In the third year of hi reign, he made a feast unto all
hi princ and hi servants; the power of persia and media, the
nobl and princ of the provinces, be befor him: 1:4 when he
shew the rich of hi gloriou kingdom and the honour of his
excel majesti mani days, even an hundr and fourscor days.

1:5 and when these day were expired, the king made a feast unto all
th peopl that were present in shushan the palace, both unto great
and small, seven days, in the court of the garden of the king's
palace; 1:6 where were white, green, and blue, hangings, fasten with
cord of fine linen and purpl to silver ring and pillar of marble:
th bed were of gold and silver, upon a pavement of red, and blue,
and white, and black, marble.

1:7 and they gave them drink in vessel of gold, (the vessel being
divers one from another,) and royal wine in abundance, accord to
th state of the king.

1:8 and the drink wa accord to the law; none did compel: for so
th king had appoint to all the offic of hi house, that they
should do accord to everi man' pleasure.

1:9 also vashti the queen made a feast for the women in the royal
hous which belong to king ahasuerus.

1:10 On the seventh day, when the heart of the king wa merri with
wine, he command mehuman, biztha, harbona, bigtha, and abagtha,
zethar, and carcas, the seven chamberlain that serv in the presence
of ahasueru the king, 1:11 To bring vashti the queen befor the king
with the crown royal, to shew the peopl and the princ her beauty:
for she wa fair to look on.

1:12 but the queen vashti refus to come at the king' command by
hi chamberlains: therefor wa the king veri wroth, and hi anger
burn in him.

1:13 then the king said to the wise men, which knew the times, (for so
wa the king' manner toward all that knew law and judgment: 1:14 and
th next unto him wa carshena, shethar, admatha, tarshish, meres,
marsena, and memucan, the seven princ of persia and media, which saw
th king' face, and which sat the first in the kingdom;) 1:15 what
shal we do unto the queen vashti accord to law, becaus she hath
not perform the command of the king ahasueru by the
chamberlains?  1:16 and memucan answer befor the king and the
princes, vashti the queen hath not done wrong to the king only, but
also to all the princes, and to all the peopl that are in all the
provinc of the king ahasuerus.

1:17 for thi deed of the queen shall come abroad unto all women, so
that they shall despis their husband in their eyes, when it shall be
reported, the king ahasueru command vashti the queen to be brought
in befor him, but she came not.

1:18 likewis shall the ladi of persia and media say thi day unto
al the king' princes, which have heard of the deed of the queen.
thu shall there aris too much contempt and wrath.

1:19 If it pleas the king, let there go a royal command from him,
and let it be written among the law of the persian and the medes,
that it be not altered, that vashti come no more befor king
ahasuerus; and let the king give her royal estat unto anoth that is
bett than she.

1:20 and when the king' decre which he shall make shall be published
throughout all hi empire, (for it is great,) all the wive shall give
to their husband honour, both to great and small.

1:21 and the say pleas the king and the princes; and the king did
accord to the word of memucan: 1:22 for he sent letter into all
th king' provinces, into everi provinc accord to the writing
thereof, and to everi peopl after their language, that everi man
should bear rule in hi own house, and that it should be published
accord to the languag of everi people.

2:1 after these things, when the wrath of king ahasueru wa appeased,
h rememb vashti, and what she had done, and what wa decreed
against her.

2:2 then said the king' servant that minist unto him, let there
b fair young virgin sought for the king: 2:3 and let the king
appoint offic in all the provinc of hi kingdom, that they may
gath togeth all the fair young virgin unto shushan the palace, to
th hous of the women, unto the custodi of hege the king's
chamberlain, keeper of the women; and let their thing for
purif be given them: 2:4 and let the maiden which pleaseth the
k be queen instead of vashti.

and the thing pleas the king; and he did so.

2:5 now in shushan the palac there wa a certain jew, whose name was
mordecai, the son of jair, the son of shimei, the son of kish, a
benjamite; 2:6 who had been carri away from jerusalem with the
capt which had been carri away with jeconiah king of judah,
whom nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon had carri away.

2:7 and he brought up hadassah, that is, esther, hi uncle' daughter:
for she had neither father nor mother, and the maid wa fair and
beautiful; whom mordecai, when her father and mother were dead, took
for hi own daughter.

2:8 So it came to pass, when the king' command and hi decre was
heard, and when mani maiden were gather togeth unto shushan the
palace, to the custodi of hegai, that esther wa brought also unto the
king' house, to the custodi of hegai, keeper of the women.

2:9 and the maiden pleas him, and she obtain kind of him; and
h speedili gave her her thing for purification, with such thing as
belong to her, and seven maidens, which were meet to be given her,
out of the king' house: and he prefer her and her maid unto the
best place of the hous of the women.

2:10 esther had not shew her peopl nor her kindred: for mordecai
had charg her that she should not shew it.

2:11 and mordecai walk everi day befor the court of the women's
house, to know how esther did, and what should becom of her.

2:12 now when everi maid' turn wa come to go in to king ahasuerus,
aft that she had been twelv months, accord to the manner of the
women, (for so were the day of their purif accomplished, to
wit, six month with oil of myrrh, and six month with sweet odours,
and with other thing for the purifi of the women;) 2:13 then thus
cam everi maiden unto the king; whatsoev she desir wa given her
to go with her out of the hous of the women unto the king' house.

2:14 In the even she went, and on the morrow she return into the
second hous of the women, to the custodi of shaashgaz, the king's
chamberlain, which kept the concubines: she came in unto the king no
more, except the king delight in her, and that she were call by
name.

2:15 now when the turn of esther, the daughter of abihail the uncl of
mordecai, who had taken her for hi daughter, wa come to go in unto
th king, she requir noth but what hegai the king' chamberlain,
th keeper of the women, appointed. and esther obtain favour in the
sight of all them that look upon her.

2:16 So esther wa taken unto king ahasueru into hi hous royal in
th tenth month, which is the month tebeth, in the seventh year of his
reign.

2:17 and the king love esther abov all the women, and she obtained
grac and favour in hi sight more than all the virgins; so that he
set the royal crown upon her head, and made her queen instead of
vashti.

2:18 then the king made a great feast unto all hi princ and his
servants, even esther' feast; and he made a releas to the provinces,
and gave gifts, accord to the state of the king.

2:19 and when the virgin were gather togeth the second time, then
mordecai sat in the king' gate.

2:20 esther had not yet shew her kindr nor her people; as mordecai
had charg her: for esther did the command of mordecai, like as
when she wa brought up with him.

2:21 In those days, while mordecai sat in the king' gate, two of the
king' chamberlains, bigthan and teresh, of those which kept the door,
wer wroth, and sought to lay hand on the king ahasuerus.

2:22 and the thing wa known to mordecai, who told it unto esther the
queen; and esther certifi the king thereof in mordecai' name.

2:23 and when inquisit wa made of the matter, it wa found out;
therefor they were both hang on a tree: and it wa written in the
book of the chronicl befor the king.

3:1 after these thing did king ahasueru promot haman the son of
hammedatha the agagite, and advanc him, and set hi seat abov all
th princ that were with him.

3:2 and all the king' servants, that were in the king' gate, bowed,
and reverenc haman: for the king had so command concern him.
but mordecai bow not, nor did him reverence.

3:3 then the king' servants, which were in the king' gate, said unto
mordecai, whi transgressest thou the king' commandment?  3:4 now it
cam to pass, when they spake daili unto him, and he hearken not
unto them, that they told haman, to see whether mordecai' matters
would stand: for he had told them that he wa a jew.

3:5 and when haman saw that mordecai bow not, nor did him reverence,
then wa haman full of wrath.

3:6 and he thought scorn to lay hand on mordecai alone; for they had
shew him the peopl of mordecai: wherefor haman sought to destroy
al the jew that were throughout the whole kingdom of ahasuerus, even
th peopl of mordecai.

3:7 In the first month, that is, the month nisan, in the twelfth year
of king ahasuerus, they cast pur, that is, the lot, befor haman from
day to day, and from month to month, to the twelfth month, that is,
th month adar.

3:8 and haman said unto king ahasuerus, there is a certain people
scatt abroad and dispers among the peopl in all the provinces
of thi kingdom; and their law are divers from all people; neither
keep they the king' laws: therefor it is not for the king' profit
to suffer them.

3:9 If it pleas the king, let it be written that they may be
destroyed: and I will pay ten thousand talent of silver to the hands
of those that have the charg of the business, to bring it into the
king' treasuries.

3:10 and the king took hi ring from hi hand, and gave it unto haman
th son of hammedatha the agagite, the jews' enemy.

3:11 and the king said unto haman, the silver is given to thee, the
peopl also, to do with them as it seemeth good to thee.

3:12 then were the king' scribe call on the thirteenth day of the
first month, and there wa written accord to all that haman had
command unto the king' lieutenants, and to the governor that were
ov everi province, and to the ruler of everi peopl of every
provinc accord to the write thereof, and to everi peopl after
their language; in the name of king ahasueru wa it written, and
seal with the king' ring.

3:13 and the letter were sent by post into all the king' provinces,
to destroy, to kill, and to caus to perish, all jews, both young and
old, littl children and women, in one day, even upon the thirteenth
day of the twelfth month, which is the month adar, and to take the
spoil of them for a prey.

3:14 the copi of the write for a command to be given in every
provinc wa publish unto all people, that they should be ready
against that day.

3:15 the post went out, be hasten by the king' commandment, and
th decre wa given in shushan the palace. and the king and haman sat
down to drink; but the citi shushan wa perplexed.

4:1 when mordecai perceiv all that wa done, mordecai rent his
clothes, and put on sackcloth with ashes, and went out into the midst
of the city, and cri with a loud and a bitter cry; 4:2 and came even
befor the king' gate: for none might enter into the king' gate
cloth with sackcloth.

4:3 and in everi province, whithersoev the king' command and
hi decre came, there wa great mourn among the jews, and fasting,
and weeping, and wailing; and mani lay in sackcloth and ashes.

4:4 So esther' maid and her chamberlain came and told it her. then
wa the queen exceedingli grieved; and she sent raiment to clothe
mordecai, and to take away hi sackcloth from him: but he receiv it
not.

4:5 then call esther for hatach, one of the king' chamberlains,
whom he had appoint to attend upon her, and gave him a commandment
to mordecai, to know what it was, and whi it was.

4:6 So hatach went forth to mordecai unto the street of the city,
which wa befor the king' gate.

4:7 and mordecai told him of all that had happen unto him, and of
th sum of the money that haman had promis to pay to the king's
treasuri for the jews, to destroy them.

4:8 also he gave him the copi of the write of the decre that was
given at shushan to destroy them, to shew it unto esther, and to
declar it unto her, and to charg her that she should go in unto the
king, to make supplic unto him, and to make request befor him
for her people.

4:9 and hatach came and told esther the word of mordecai.

4:10 again esther spake unto hatach, and gave him command unto
mordecai; 4:11 all the king' servants, and the peopl of the king's
provinces, do know, that whosoever, whether man or women, shall come
unto the king into the inner court, who is not called, there is one
law of hi to put him to death, except such to whom the king shall
hold out the golden sceptre, that he may live: but I have not been
cal to come in unto the king these thirti days.

4:12 and they told to mordecai esther' words.

4:13 then mordecai command to answer esther, think not with thyself
that thou shalt escap in the king' house, more than all the jews.

4:14 for if thou altogeth holdest thi peac at thi time, then shall
ther enlarg and deliver aris to the jew from another
place; but thou and thi father' hous shall be destroyed: and who
knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
4:15 then esther bade them return mordecai thi answer, 4:16 go,
gath togeth all the jew that are present in shushan, and fast ye
for me, and neither eat nor drink three days, night or day: I also and
mi maiden will fast likewise; and so will I go in unto the king,
which is not accord to the law: and if I perish, I perish.

4:17 So mordecai went hi way, and did accord to all that esther
had command him.

5:1 now it came to pass on the third day, that esther put on her royal
apparel, and stood in the inner court of the king' house, over
against the king' house: and the king sat upon hi royal throne in
th royal house, over against the gate of the house.

5:2 and it wa so, when the king saw esther the queen stand in the
court, that she obtain favour in hi sight: and the king held out to
esth the golden sceptr that wa in hi hand. So esther drew near,
and touch the top of the sceptre.

5:3 then said the king unto her, what wilt thou, queen esther? and
what is thi request? it shall be even given thee to the half of the
kingdom.

5:4 and esther answered, If it seem good unto the king, let the king
and haman come thi day unto the banquet that I have prepar for him.

5:5 then the king said, caus haman to make haste, that he may do as
esth hath said. So the king and haman came to the banquet that
esth had prepared.

5:6 and the king said unto esther at the banquet of wine, what is thy
petition? and it shall be grant thee: and what is thi request? even
to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed.

5:7 then answer esther, and said, My petit and my request is; 5:8
if I have found favour in the sight of the king, and if it pleas the
k to grant my petition, and to perform my request, let the king and
haman come to the banquet that I shall prepar for them, and I will do
to morrow as the king hath said.

5:9 then went haman forth that day joy and with a glad heart: but
when haman saw mordecai in the king' gate, that he stood not up, nor
mov for him, he wa full of indign against mordecai.

5:10 nevertheless haman refrain himself: and when he came home, he
sent and call for hi friends, and zeresh hi wife.

5:11 and haman told them of the glori of hi riches, and the multitude
of hi children, and all the thing wherein the king had promot him,
and how he had advanc him abov the princ and servant of the
king.

5:12 haman said moreover, yea, esther the queen did let no man come in
with the king unto the banquet that she had prepar but myself; and
to morrow am I invit unto her also with the king.

5:13 yet all thi availeth me nothing, so long as I see mordecai the
jew sit at the king' gate.

5:14 then said zeresh hi wife and all hi friend unto him, let a
gallow be made of fifti cubit high, and to morrow speak thou unto
th king that mordecai may be hang thereon: then go thou in merrily
with the king unto the banquet. and the thing pleas haman; and he
caus the gallow to be made.

6:1 On that night could not the king sleep, and he command to bring
th book of record of the chronicles; and they were read befor the
king.

6:2 and it wa found written, that mordecai had told of bigthana and
teresh, two of the king' chamberlains, the keeper of the door, who
sought to lay hand on the king ahasuerus.

6:3 and the king said, what honour and digniti hath been done to
mordecai for this? then said the king' servant that minist unto
him, there is noth done for him.

6:4 and the king said, who is in the court? now haman wa come into
th outward court of the king' house, to speak unto the king to hang
mordecai on the gallow that he had prepar for him.

6:5 and the king' servant said unto him, behold, haman standeth in
th court. and the king said, let him come in.

6:6 So haman came in. and the king said unto him, what shall be done
unto the man whom the king delighteth to honour? now haman thought in
hi heart, To whom would the king delight to do honour more than to
myself?  6:7 and haman answer the king, for the man whom the king
delighteth to honour, 6:8 let the royal apparel be brought which the
k useth to wear, and the hors that the king rideth upon, and the
crown royal which is set upon hi head: 6:9 and let thi apparel and
hors be deliv to the hand of one of the king' most noble
princes, that they may array the man withal whom the king delighteth
to honour, and bring him on horseback through the street of the city,
and proclaim befor him, thu shall it be done to the man whom the
k delighteth to honour.

6:10 then the king said to haman, make haste, and take the apparel and
th horse, as thou hast said, and do even so to mordecai the jew, that
sitteth at the king' gate: let noth fail of all that thou hast
spoken.

6:11 then took haman the apparel and the horse, and array mordecai,
and brought him on horseback through the street of the city, and
proclaim befor him, thu shall it be done unto the man whom the
k delighteth to honour.

6:12 and mordecai came again to the king' gate. but haman hast to
hi hous mourning, and have hi head covered.

6:13 and haman told zeresh hi wife and all hi friend everi thing
that had befallen him. then said hi wise men and zeresh hi wife unto
him, If mordecai be of the seed of the jews, befor whom thou hast
begun to fall, thou shalt not prevail against him, but shalt surely
fal befor him.

6:14 and while they were yet talk with him, came the king's
chamberlains, and hast to bring haman unto the banquet that esther
had prepared.

7:1 So the king and haman came to banquet with esther the queen.

7:2 and the king said again unto esther on the second day at the
banquet of wine, what is thi petition, queen esther? and it shall be
grant thee: and what is thi request? and it shall be performed, even
to the half of the kingdom.

7:3 then esther the queen answer and said, If I have found favour in
thi sight, O king, and if it pleas the king, let my life be given me
at my petition, and my peopl at my request: 7:4 for we are sold, i
and my people, to be destroyed, to be slain, and to perish. but if we
had been sold for bondmen and bondwomen, I had held my tongue,
although the enemi could not countervail the king' damage.

7:5 then the king ahasueru answer and said unto esther the queen,
who is he, and where is he, that durst presum in hi heart to do so?
7:6 and esther said, the adversari and enemi is thi wick haman.
then haman wa afraid befor the king and the queen.

7:7 and the king aris from the banquet of wine in hi wrath went
into the palac garden: and haman stood up to make request for his
lif to esther the queen; for he saw that there wa evil determined
against him by the king.

7:8 then the king return out of the palac garden into the place of
th banquet of wine; and haman wa fallen upon the bed whereon esther
was. then said the king, will he forc the queen also befor me in the
house? As the word went out of king' mouth, they cover haman's
face.

7:9 and harbonah, one of the chamberlains, said befor the king,
behold also, the gallow fifti cubit high, which haman had made for
mordecai, who spoken good for the king, standeth in the hous of
haman. then the king said, hang him thereon.

7:10 So they hang haman on the gallow that he had prepar for
mordecai. then wa the king' wrath pacified.

8:1 On that day did the king ahasueru give the hous of haman the
jews' enemi unto esther the queen. and mordecai came befor the king;
for esther had told what he wa unto her.

8:2 and the king took off hi ring, which he had taken from haman, and
gav it unto mordecai. and esther set mordecai over the hous of
haman.

8:3 and esther spake yet again befor the king, and fell down at his
feet, and besought him with tear to put away the mischief of haman
th agagite, and hi devic that he had devis against the jews.

8:4 then the king held out the golden sceptr toward esther. So esther
arose, and stood befor the king, 8:5 and said, If it pleas the king,
and if I have favour in hi sight, and the thing seem right befor the
king, and I be pleas in hi eyes, let it be written to revers the
lett devis by haman the son of hammedatha the agagite, which he
wrot to destroy the jew which are in all the king' provinces: 8:6
for how can I endur to see the evil that shall come unto my people?
or how can I endur to see the destruct of my kindred?  8:7 then
th king ahasueru said unto esther the queen and to mordecai the jew,
behold, I have given esther the hous of haman, and him they have
hang upon the gallows, becaus he laid hi hand upon the jews.

8:8 write ye also for the jews, as it liketh you, in the king' name,
and seal it with the king' ring: for the write which is written in
th king' name, and seal with the king' ring, may no man reverse.

8:9 then were the king' scribe call at that time in the third
month, that is, the month sivan, on the three and twentieth day
thereof; and it wa written accord to all that mordecai commanded
unto the jews, and to the lieutenants, and the deputi and ruler of
th provinc which are from india unto ethiopia, an hundr twenty
and seven provinces, unto everi provinc accord to the writing
thereof, and unto everi peopl after their language, and to the jews
accord to their writing, and accord to their language.

8:10 and he wrote in the king ahasuerus' name, and seal it with the
king' ring, and sent letter by post on horseback, and rider on
mules, camels, and young dromedaries: 8:11 wherein the king granted
th jew which were in everi citi to gather themselv together, and
to stand for their life, to destroy, to slay and to caus to perish,
al the power of the peopl and provinc that would assault them, both
littl one and women, and to take the spoil of them for a prey, 8:12
upon one day in all the provinc of king ahasuerus, namely, upon the
thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month adar.

8:13 the copi of the write for a command to be given in every
provinc wa publish unto all people, and that the jew should be
readi against that day to aveng themselv on their enemies.

8:14 So the post that rode upon mule and camel went out, being
hasten and press on by the king' commandment. and the decre was
given at shushan the palace.

8:15 and mordecai went out from the presenc of the king in royal
apparel of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold, and with a
gar of fine linen and purple: and the citi of shushan rejoic and
wa glad.

8:16 the jew had light, and gladness, and joy, and honour.

8:17 and in everi province, and in everi city, whithersoev the
king' command and hi decre came, the jew had joy and gladness,
a feast and a good day. and mani of the peopl of the land became
jews; for the fear of the jew fell upon them.

9:1 now in the twelfth month, that is, the month adar, on the
thirteenth day of the same, when the king' command and hi decree
drew near to be put in execution, in the day that the enemi of the
jew hope to have power over them, (though it wa turn to the
contrary, that the jew had rule over them that hate them;) 9:2 the
jew gather themselv togeth in their citi throughout all the
provinc of the king ahasuerus, to lay hand on such as sought their
hurt: and no man could withstand them; for the fear of them fell upon
al people.

9:3 and all the ruler of the provinces, and the lieutenants, and the
deputies, and offic of the king, help the jews; becaus the fear
of mordecai fell upon them.

9:4 for mordecai wa great in the king' house, and hi fame went out
throughout all the provinces: for thi man mordecai wax greater and
greater.

9:5 thu the jew smote all their enemi with the stroke of the
sword, and slaughter, and destruction, and did what they would unto
thos that hate them.

9:6 and in shushan the palac the jew slew and destroy five hundred
men.

9:7 and parshandatha, and dalphon, and aspatha, 9:8 and poratha, and
adalia, and aridatha, 9:9 and parmashta, and arisai, and aridai, and
vajezatha, 9:10 the ten son of haman the son of hammedatha, the enemy
of the jews, slew they; but on the spoil laid they not their hand.

9:11 On that day the number of those that were slain in shushan the
palac wa brought befor the king.

9:12 and the king said unto esther the queen, the jew have slain and
destroy five hundr men in shushan the palace, and the ten son of
haman; what have they done in the rest of the king' provinces? now
what is thi petition? and it shall be grant thee: or what is thy
request further? and it shall be done.

9:13 then said esther, If it pleas the king, let it be grant to the
jew which are in shushan to do to morrow also accord unto this
day' decree, and let haman' ten son be hang upon the gallows.

9:14 and the king command it so to be done: and the decre wa given
at shushan; and they hang haman' ten sons.

9:15 for the jew that were in shushan gather themselv togeth on
th fourteenth day also of the month adar, and slew three hundr men
at shushan; but on the prey they laid not their hand.

9:16 but the other jew that were in the king' provinc gathered
themselv together, and stood for their lives, and had rest from
their enemies, and slew of their foe seventi and five thousand, but
they laid not their hand on the prey, 9:17 On the thirteenth day of
th month adar; and on the fourteenth day of the same rest they, and
mad it a day of feast and gladness.

9:18 but the jew that were at shushan assembl togeth on the
thirteenth day thereof, and on the fourteenth thereof; and on the
fifteenth day of the same they rested, and made it a day of feasting
and gladness.

9:19 therefor the jew of the villages, that dwelt in the unwalled
towns, made the fourteenth day of the month adar a day of glad and
feasting, and a good day, and of send portion one to another.

9:20 and mordecai wrote these things, and sent letter unto all the
jew that were in all the provinc of the king ahasuerus, both nigh
and far, 9:21 To stablish thi among them, that they should keep the
fourteenth day of the month adar, and the fifteenth day of the same,
yearly, 9:22 As the day wherein the jew rest from their enemies,
and the month which wa turn unto them from sorrow to joy, and from
mourn into a good day: that they should make them day of feasting
and joy, and of send portion one to another, and gift to the
poor.

9:23 and the jew undertook to do as they had begun, and as mordecai
had written unto them; 9:24 becaus haman the son of hammedatha, the
agagite, the enemi of all the jews, had devis against the jew to
destroy them, and had cast pur, that is, the lot, to consum them, and
to destroy them; 9:25 but when esther came befor the king, he
command by letter that hi wick device, which he devis against
th jews, should return upon hi own head, and that he and hi sons
should be hang on the gallows.

9:26 wherefor they call these day purim after the name of pur.

therefor for all the word of thi letter, and of that which they had
seen concern thi matter, and which had come unto them, 9:27 the
jew ordained, and took upon them, and upon their seed, and upon all
such as join themselv unto them, so as it should not fail, that
they would keep these two day accord to their writing, and
accord to their appoint time everi year; 9:28 and that these days
should be rememb and kept throughout everi generation, every
family, everi province, and everi city; and that these day of purim
should not fail from among the jews, nor the memori of them perish
from their seed.

9:29 then esther the queen, the daughter of abihail, and mordecai the
jew, wrote with all authority, to confirm thi second letter of purim.

9:30 and he sent the letter unto all the jews, to the hundr twenty
and seven provinc of the kingdom of ahasuerus, with word of peace
and truth, 9:31 To confirm these day of purim in their times
appointed, accord as mordecai the jew and esther the queen had
enjoin them, and as they had decre for themselv and for their
seed, the matter of the fast and their cry.

9:32 and the decre of esther confirm these matter of purim; and it
wa written in the book.

10:1 and the king ahasueru laid a tribut upon the land, and upon the
isl of the sea.

10:2 and all the act of hi power and of hi might, and the
declar of the great of mordecai, whereunto the king advanced
him, are they not written in the book of the chronicl of the kings
of media and persia?  10:3 for mordecai the jew wa next unto king
ahasuerus, and great among the jews, and accept of the multitud of
hi brethren, seek the wealth of hi people, and speak peac to
al hi seed.




th book of job


1:1 there wa a man in the land of uz, whose name wa job; and that
man wa perfect and upright, and one that fear god, and eschew evil.

1:2 and there were born unto him seven son and three daughters.

1:3 hi substanc also wa seven thousand sheep, and three thousand
camels, and five hundr yoke of oxen, and five hundr she asses, and
a veri great household; so that thi man wa the greatest of all the
men of the east.

1:4 and hi son went and feast in their houses, everi one hi day;
and sent and call for their three sister to eat and to drink with
them.

1:5 and it wa so, when the day of their feast were gone about,
that job sent and sanctifi them, and rose up earli in the morning,
and offer burnt offer accord to the number of them all: for
job said, It may be that my son have sinned, and curs god in their
hearts. thu did job continually.

1:6 now there wa a day when the son of god came to present
themselv befor the lord, and satan came also among them.

1:7 and the lord said unto satan, whenc comest thou? then satan
answ the lord, and said, from go to and fro in the earth, and
from walk up and down in it.

1:8 and the lord said unto satan, hast thou consid my servant job,
that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright
man, one that feareth god, and escheweth evil?  1:9 then satan
answ the lord, and said, doth job fear god for nought?  1:10 hast
not thou made an hedg about him, and about hi house, and about all
that he hath on everi side? thou hast bless the work of hi hands,
and hi substanc is increas in the land.

1:11 but put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he
wil curs thee to thi face.

1:12 and the lord said unto satan, behold, all that he hath is in thy
power; onli upon himself put not forth thine hand. So satan went forth
from the presenc of the lord.

1:13 and there wa a day when hi son and hi daughter were eating
and drink wine in their eldest brother' house: 1:14 and there came
a messeng unto job, and said, the oxen were plowing, and the asses
feed besid them: 1:15 and the sabean fell upon them, and took
them away; yea, they have slain the servant with the edg of the
sword; and I onli am escap alon to tell thee.

1:16 while he wa yet speaking, there came also another, and said, the
fir of god is fallen from heaven, and hath burn up the sheep, and
th servants, and consum them; and I onli am escap alon to tell
thee.

1:17 while he wa yet speaking, there came also another, and said, the
chaldean made out three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have
carri them away, yea, and slain the servant with the edg of the
sword; and I onli am escap alon to tell thee.

1:18 while he wa yet speaking, there came also another, and said, thy
son and thi daughter were eat and drink wine in their eldest
brother' house: 1:19 and, behold, there came a great wind from the
wilderness, and smote the four corner of the house, and it fell upon
th young men, and they are dead; and I onli am escap alon to tell
thee.

1:20 then job arose, and rent hi mantle, and shave hi head, and
fel down upon the ground, and worshipped, 1:21 and said, nake came i
out of my mother' womb, and nake shall I return thither: the lord
gave, and the lord hath taken away; bless be the name of the lord.

1:22 In all thi job sin not, nor charg god foolishly.

2:1 again there wa a day when the son of god came to present
themselv befor the lord, and satan came also among them to present
himself befor the lord.

2:2 and the lord said unto satan, from whenc comest thou? and satan
answ the lord, and said, from go to and fro in the earth, and
from walk up and down in it.

2:3 and the lord said unto satan, hast thou consid my servant job,
that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright
man, one that feareth god, and escheweth evil? and still he holdeth
fast hi integrity, although thou movedst me against him, to destroy
him without cause.

2:4 and satan answer the lord, and said, skin for skin, yea, all
that a man hath will he give for hi life.

2:5 but put forth thine hand now, and touch hi bone and hi flesh,
and he will curs thee to thi face.

2:6 and the lord said unto satan, behold, he is in thine hand; but
sav hi life.

2:7 So went satan forth from the presenc of the lord, and smote job
with sore boil from the sole of hi foot unto hi crown.

2:8 and he took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat
down among the ashes.

2:9 then said hi wife unto him, dost thou still retain thine
integrity?  curs god, and die.

2:10 but he said unto her, thou speakest as one of the foolish women
speaketh. what? shall we receiv good at the hand of god, and shall we
not receiv evil? In all thi did not job sin with hi lips.

2:11 now when job' three friend heard of all thi evil that wa come
upon him, they came everi one from hi own place; eliphaz the
temanite, and bildad the shuhite, and zophar the naamathite: for they
had made an appoint togeth to come to mourn with him and to
comfort him.

2:12 and when they lift up their eye afar off, and knew him not,
they lift up their voice, and wept; and they rent everi one his
mantle, and sprinkl dust upon their head toward heaven.

2:13 So they sat down with him upon the ground seven day and seven
nights, and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that hi grief
wa veri great.

3:1 after thi open job hi mouth, and curs hi day.

3:2 and job spake, and said, 3:3 let the day perish wherein I was
born, and the night in which it wa said, there is a man child
conceived.

3:4 let that day be darkness; let not god regard it from above,
neith let the light shine upon it.

3:5 let dark and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell
upon it; let the black of the day terrifi it.

3:6 As for that night, let dark seiz upon it; let it not be
join unto the day of the year, let it not come into the number of
th months.

3:7 lo, let that night be solitary, let no joy voic come therein.

3:8 let them curs it that curs the day, who are readi to rais up
their mourning.

3:9 let the star of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for
light, but have none; neither let it see the dawn of the day: 3:10
becaus it shut not up the door of my mother' womb, nor hid sorrow
from mine eyes.

3:11 whi die I not from the womb? whi did I not give up the ghost
when I came out of the belly?  3:12 whi did the knee prevent me? or
whi the breast that I should suck?  3:13 for now should I have lain
stil and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
3:14 with king and counsellor of the earth, which build desolate
plac for themselves; 3:15 Or with princ that had gold, who filled
their hous with silver: 3:16 Or as an hidden untim birth I had
not been; as infant which never saw light.

3:17 there the wick ceas from troubling; and there the weari be at
rest.

3:18 there the prison rest together; they hear not the voic of the
oppressor.

3:19 the small and great are there; and the servant is free from his
master.

3:20 wherefor is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto
th bitter in soul; 3:21 which long for death, but it cometh not; and
dig for it more than for hid treasures; 3:22 which rejoice
exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?  3:23 whi is
light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom god hath hedg in?
3:24 for my sigh cometh befor I eat, and my roar are poured
out like the waters.

3:25 for the thing which I greatli fear is come upon me, and that
which I wa afraid of is come unto me.

3:26 I wa not in safety, neither had I rest, neither wa I quiet; yet
troubl came.

4:1 then eliphaz the temanit answer and said, 4:2 If we assay to
commun with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself
from speaking?  4:3 behold, thou hast instruct many, and thou hast
strengthen the weak hands.

4:4 thi word have upholden him that wa falling, and thou hast
strengthen the feebl knees.

4:5 but now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee,
and thou art troubled.

4:6 Is not thi thi fear, thi confidence, thi hope, and the
upright of thi ways?  4:7 remember, I pray thee, who ever
perished, be innocent? or where were the righteou cut off?  4:8
even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap
th same.

4:9 By the blast of god they perish, and by the breath of hi nostrils
ar they consumed.

4:10 the roar of the lion, and the voic of the fierc lion, and
th teeth of the young lions, are broken.

4:11 the old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion's
whelp are scatter abroad.

4:12 now a thing wa secretli brought to me, and mine ear receiv a
littl thereof.

4:13 In thought from the vision of the night, when deep sleep
falleth on men, 4:14 fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all
mi bone to shake.

4:15 then a spirit pass befor my face; the hair of my flesh stood
up: 4:16 It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an
imag wa befor mine eyes, there wa silence, and I heard a voice,
saying, 4:17 shall mortal man be more just than god? shall a man be
mor pure than hi maker?  4:18 behold, he put no trust in his
servants; and hi angel he charg with folly: 4:19 how much less in
them that dwell in hous of clay, whose foundat is in the dust,
which are crush befor the moth?  4:20 they are destroy from
morn to evening: they perish for ever without ani regard it.

4:21 doth not their excel which is in them go away? they die,
even without wisdom.

5:1 call now, if there be ani that will answer thee; and to which of
th saint wilt thou turn?  5:2 for wrath killeth the foolish man, and
envi slayeth the silli one.

5:3 I have seen the foolish take root: but suddenli I curs his
habitation.

5:4 hi children are far from safety, and they are crush in the
gate, neither is there ani to deliv them.

5:5 whose harvest the hungri eateth up, and taketh it even out of the
thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.

5:6 although afflict cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth
troubl spring out of the ground; 5:7 yet man is born unto trouble, as
th spark fli upward.

5:8 I would seek unto god, and unto god would I commit my cause: 5:9
which doeth great thing and unsearchable; marvel thing without
number: 5:10 who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth water upon
th fields: 5:11 To set up on high those that be low; that those which
mourn may be exalt to safety.

5:12 He disappointeth the devic of the crafty, so that their hands
cannot perform their enterprise.

5:13 He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of
th froward is carri headlong.

5:14 they meet with dark in the day time, and grope in the noonday
a in the night.

5:15 but he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from
th hand of the mighty.

5:16 So the poor hath hope, and iniqu stoppeth her mouth.

5:17 behold, happi is the man whom god correcteth: therefor despise
not thou the chasten of the almighty: 5:18 for he maketh sore, and
bindeth up: he woundeth, and hi hand make whole.

5:19 He shall deliv thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall
no evil touch thee.

5:20 In famin he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the
pow of the sword.

5:21 thou shalt be hid from the scourg of the tongue: neither shalt
thou be afraid of destruct when it cometh.

5:22 At destruct and famin thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be
afraid of the beast of the earth.

5:23 for thou shalt be in leagu with the stone of the field: and the
beast of the field shall be at peac with thee.

5:24 and thou shalt know that thi tabernacl shall be in peace; and
thou shalt visit thi habitation, and shalt not sin.

5:25 thou shalt know also that thi seed shall be great, and thine
offspr as the grass of the earth.

5:26 thou shalt come to thi grave in a full age, like as a shock of
corn cometh in in hi season.

5:27 Lo this, we have search it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it
for thi good.

6:1 but job answer and said, 6:2 Oh that my grief were throughly
weighed, and my calam laid in the balanc together!  6:3 for now
it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefor my word are
swallow up.

6:4 for the arrow of the almighti are within me, the poison whereof
drinketh up my spirit: the terror of god do set themselv in array
against me.

6:5 doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over
hi fodder?  6:6 can that which is unsavouri be eaten without salt? or
i there ani tast in the white of an egg?  6:7 the thing that my
soul refus to touch are as my sorrow meat.

6:8 Oh that I might have my request; and that god would grant me the
th that I long for!  6:9 even that it would pleas god to destroy
me; that he would let loos hi hand, and cut me off!  6:10 then
should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let
him not spare; for I have not conceal the word of the holi one.

6:11 what is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end,
that I should prolong my life?  6:12 Is my strength the strength of
stones? or is my flesh of brass?  6:13 Is not my help in me? and is
wisdom driven quit from me?  6:14 To him that is afflict pity
should be shew from hi friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the
almighty.

6:15 My brethren have dealt deceit as a brook, and as the stream
