thin hand upon him, rememb the battle, do no more.

41:9 behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down
even at the sight of him?  41:10 none is so fierc that dare stir him
up: who then is abl to stand befor me?  41:11 who hath prevent me,
that I should repay him? whatsoev is under the whole heaven is mine.

41:12 I will not conceal hi parts, nor hi power, nor hi comely
proportion.

41:13 who can discov the face of hi garment? or who can come to him
with hi doubl bridle?  41:14 who can open the door of hi face? his
teeth are terribl round about.

41:15 hi scale are hi pride, shut up togeth as with a close seal.

41:16 one is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

41:17 they are join one to another, they stick together, that they
cannot be sundered.

41:18 By hi nees a light doth shine, and hi eye are like the
eyelid of the morning.

41:19 out of hi mouth go burn lamps, and spark of fire leap out.

41:20 out of hi nostril goeth smoke, as out of a seeth pot or
caldron.

41:21 hi breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of hi mouth.

41:22 In hi neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turn into joy
befor him.

41:23 the flake of hi flesh are join together: they are firm in
themselves; they cannot be moved.

41:24 hi heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piec of the
neth millstone.

41:25 when he raiseth up himself, the mighti are afraid: by reason of
break they purifi themselves.

41:26 the sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the
dart, nor the habergeon.

41:27 He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

41:28 the arrow cannot make him flee: slingston are turn with him
into stubble.

41:29 dart are count as stubble: he laugheth at the shake of a
spear.

41:30 sharp stone are under him: he spreadeth sharp point things
upon the mire.

41:31 He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a
pot of ointment.

41:32 He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to
b hoary.

41:33 upon earth there is not hi like, who is made without fear.

41:34 He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children
of pride.

42:1 then job answer the lord, and said, 42:2 I know that thou canst
do everi thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.

42:3 who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefor have i
utt that I understood not; thing too wonder for me, which i
knew not.

42:4 hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee,
and declar thou unto me.

42:5 I have heard of thee by the hear of the ear: but now mine eye
seeth thee.

42:6 wherefor I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

42:7 and it wa so, that after the lord had spoken these word unto
job, the lord said to eliphaz the temanite, My wrath is kindled
against thee, and against thi two friends: for ye have not spoken of
m the thing that is right, as my servant job hath.

42:8 therefor take unto you now seven bullock and seven rams, and go
to my servant job, and offer up for yourselv a burnt offering; and
mi servant job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal
with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing
which is right, like my servant job.

42:9 So eliphaz the temanit and bildad the shuhit and zophar the
naamathit went, and did accord as the lord command them: the
lord also accept job.

42:10 and the lord turn the captiv of job, when he pray for his
friends: also the lord gave job twice as much as he had before.

42:11 then came there unto him all hi brethren, and all hi sisters,
and all they that had been of hi acquaint before, and did eat
bread with him in hi house: and they bemoan him, and comfort him
ov all the evil that the lord had brought upon him: everi man also
gav him a piec of money, and everi one an ear of gold.

42:12 So the lord bless the latter end of job more than his
beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand
camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.

42:13 He had also seven son and three daughters.

42:14 and he call the name of the first, jemima; and the name of the
second, kezia; and the name of the third, kerenhappuch.

42:15 and in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters
of job: and their father gave them inherit among their brethren.

42:16 after thi live job an hundr and forti years, and saw his
sons, and hi sons' sons, even four generations.

42:17 So job died, be old and full of days.




th book of psalms


1:1 bless is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly,
nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the
scornful.

1:2 but hi delight is in the law of the lord; and in hi law doth he
medit day and night.

1:3 and he shall be like a tree plant by the river of water, that
bringeth forth hi fruit in hi season; hi leaf also shall not
wither; and whatsoev he doeth shall prosper.

1:4 the ungodli are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind
driveth away.

1:5 therefor the ungodli shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners
in the congreg of the righteous.

1:6 for the lord knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the
ungodli shall perish.



2:1 whi do the heathen rage, and the peopl imagin a vain thing?

2:2 the king of the earth set themselves, and the ruler take counsel
together, against the lord, and against hi anointed, saying,

2:3 let us break their band asunder, and cast away their cord from
us.

2:4 He that sitteth in the heaven shall laugh: the lord shall have
them in derision.

2:5 then shall he speak unto them in hi wrath, and vex them in his
sor displeasure.

2:6 yet have I set my king upon my holi hill of zion.

2:7 I will declar the decree: the lord hath said unto me, thou art my
son; thi day have I begotten thee.

2:8 ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine
inheritance, and the uttermost part of the earth for thi possession.

2:9 thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in
piec like a potter' vessel.

2:10 Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judg of
th earth.

2:11 serv the lord with fear, and rejoic with trembling.

2:12 kiss the son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when
hi wrath is kindl but a little. bless are all they that put their
trust in him.



3:1 lord, how are they increas that troubl me! mani are they that
ris up against me.

3:2 mani there be which say of my soul, there is no help for him in
god.

selah.

3:3 but thou, O lord, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up
of mine head.

3:4 I cri unto the lord with my voice, and he heard me out of his
holi hill. selah.

3:5 I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the lord sustain me.

3:6 I will not be afraid of ten thousand of people, that have set
themselv against me round about.

3:7 arise, O lord; save me, O my god: for thou hast smitten all mine
enemi upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the
ungodly.

3:8 salvat belongeth unto the lord: thi bless is upon thy
people.

selah.



4:1 hear me when I call, O god of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged
m when I wa in distress; have merci upon me, and hear my prayer.

4:2 O ye son of men, how long will ye turn my glori into shame? how
long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? selah.

4:3 but know that the lord hath set apart him that is godli for
himself: the lord will hear when I call unto him.

4:4 stand in awe, and sin not: commun with your own heart upon your
bed, and be still. selah.

4:5 offer the sacrific of righteousness, and put your trust in the
lord.

4:6 there be mani that say, who will shew us ani good? lord, lift thou
up the light of thi counten upon us.

4:7 thou hast put glad in my heart, more than in the time that
their corn and their wine increased.

4:8 I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, lord, only
makest me dwell in safety.



5:1 give ear to my words, O lord, consid my meditation.

5:2 hearken unto the voic of my cry, my king, and my god: for unto
the will I pray.

5:3 My voic shalt thou hear in the morning, O lord; in the morning
wil I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

5:4 for thou art not a god that hath pleasur in wickedness: neither
shal evil dwell with thee.

5:5 the foolish shall not stand in thi sight: thou hatest all workers
of iniquity.

5:6 thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the lord will abhor
th bloodi and deceit man.

5:7 but as for me, I will come into thi hous in the multitud of thy
mercy: and in thi fear will I worship toward thi holi temple.

5:8 lead me, O lord, in thi righteous becaus of mine enemies;
mak thi way straight befor my face.

5:9 for there is no faith in their mouth; their inward part is
veri wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with
their tongue.

5:10 destroy thou them, O god; let them fall by their own counsels;
cast them out in the multitud of their transgressions; for they have
rebel against thee.

5:11 but let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them
ev shout for joy, becaus thou defendest them: let them also that
lov thi name be joy in thee.

5:12 for thou, lord, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou
compass him as with a shield.



6:1 O lord, rebuk me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy
hot displeasure.

6:2 have merci upon me, O lord; for I am weak: O lord, heal me; for my
bon are vexed.

6:3 My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O lord, how long?

6:4 return, O lord, deliv my soul: oh save me for thi mercies' sake.

6:5 for in death there is no remembr of thee: in the grave who
shal give thee thanks?

6:6 I am weari with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim;
i water my couch with my tears.

6:7 mine eye is consum becaus of grief; it waxeth old becaus of
al mine enemies.

6:8 depart from me, all ye worker of iniquity; for the lord hath
heard the voic of my weeping.

6:9 the lord hath heard my supplication; the lord will receiv my
prayer.

6:10 let all mine enemi be asham and sore vexed: let them return
and be asham suddenly.



7:1 O lord my god, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them
that persecut me, and deliv me:

7:2 lest he tear my soul like a lion, rend it in pieces, while
ther is none to deliver.

7:3 O lord my god, If I have done this; if there be iniqu in my
hands;

7:4 If I have reward evil unto him that wa at peac with me; (yea,
i have deliv him that without caus is mine enemy:)

7:5 let the enemi persecut my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread
down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. selah.

7:6 arise, O lord, in thine anger, lift up thyself becaus of the rage
of mine enemies: and awak for me to the judgment that thou hast
commanded.

7:7 So shall the congreg of the peopl compass thee about: for
their sake therefor return thou on high.

7:8 the lord shall judg the people: judg me, O lord, accord to my
righteousness, and accord to mine integr that is in me.

7:9 Oh let the wicked of the wick come to an end; but establish
th just: for the righteou god trieth the heart and reins.

7:10 My defenc is of god, which saveth the upright in heart.

7:11 god judgeth the righteous, and god is angri with the wick every
day.

7:12 If he turn not, he will whet hi sword; he hath bent hi bow, and
mad it ready.

7:13 He hath also prepar for him the instrument of death; he
ordaineth hi arrow against the persecutors.

7:14 behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceiv mischief,
and brought forth falsehood.

7:15 He made a pit, and dig it, and is fallen into the ditch which
h made.

7:16 hi mischief shall return upon hi own head, and hi violent
d shall come down upon hi own pate.

7:17 I will prais the lord accord to hi righteousness: and will
s prais to the name of the lord most high.



8:1 O lord, our lord, how excel is thi name in all the earth! who
hast set thi glori abov the heavens.

8:2 out of the mouth of babe and suckl hast thou ordained
strength becaus of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy
and the avenger.

8:3 when I consid thi heavens, the work of thi fingers, the moon and
th stars, which thou hast ordained;

8:4 what is man, that thou art mind of him? and the son of man,
that thou visitest him?

8:5 for thou hast made him a littl lower than the angels, and hast
crown him with glori and honour.

8:6 thou madest him to have dominion over the work of thi hands; thou
hast put all thing under hi feet:

8:7 all sheep and oxen, yea, and the beast of the field;

8:8 the fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever
passeth through the path of the seas.

8:9 O lord our lord, how excel is thi name in all the earth!


9:1 I will prais thee, O lord, with my whole heart; I will shew forth
al thi marvel works.

9:2 I will be glad and rejoic in thee: I will sing prais to thy
name, O thou most high.

9:3 when mine enemi are turn back, they shall fall and perish at
thi presence.

9:4 for thou hast maintain my right and my cause; thou satest in the
thron judg right.

9:5 thou hast rebuk the heathen, thou hast destroy the wicked,
th hast put out their name for ever and ever.

9:6 O thou enemy, destruct are come to a perpetu end: and thou
hast destroy cities; their memori is perish with them.

9:7 but the lord shall endur for ever: he hath prepar hi throne
for judgment.

9:8 and he shall judg the world in righteousness, he shall minister
judg to the peopl in uprightness.

9:9 the lord also will be a refug for the oppressed, a refug in
tim of trouble.

9:10 and they that know thi name will put their trust in thee: for
thou, lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

9:11 sing prais to the lord, which dwelleth in zion: declar among
th peopl hi doings.

9:12 when he maketh inquisit for blood, he remembereth them: he
forgetteth not the cri of the humble.

9:13 have merci upon me, O lord; consid my troubl which I suffer of
them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gate of death:

9:14 that I may shew forth all thi prais in the gate of the daughter
of zion: I will rejoic in thi salvation.

9:15 the heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net
which they hid is their own foot taken.

9:16 the lord is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked
i snare in the work of hi own hands. higgaion. selah.

9:17 the wick shall be turn into hell, and all the nation that
forget god.

9:18 for the needi shall not alway be forgotten: the expect of
th poor shall not perish for ever.

9:19 arise, O lord; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judg in
thi sight.

9:20 put them in fear, O lord: that the nation may know themselv to
b but men. selah.



10:1 whi standest thou afar off, O lord? whi hidest thou thyself in
tim of trouble?

10:2 the wick in hi pride doth persecut the poor: let them be
taken in the devic that they have imagined.

10:3 for the wick boasteth of hi heart' desire, and blesseth the
covetous, whom the lord abhorreth.

10:4 the wicked, through the pride of hi countenance, will not seek
aft god: god is not in all hi thoughts.

10:5 hi way are alway grievous; thi judgment are far abov out of
hi sight: as for all hi enemies, he puffeth at them.

10:6 He hath said in hi heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall
nev be in adversity.

10:7 hi mouth is full of curs and deceit and fraud: under his
tongu is mischief and vanity.

10:8 He sitteth in the lurk place of the villages: in the secret
plac doth he murder the innocent: hi eye are privili set against
th poor.

10:9 He lieth in wait secretli as a lion in hi den: he lieth in wait
to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into
hi net.

10:10 He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by
hi strong ones.

10:11 He hath said in hi heart, god hath forgotten: he hideth his
face; he will never see it.

10:12 arise, O lord; O god, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

10:13 wherefor doth the wick contemn god? he hath said in his
heart, thou wilt not requir it.

10:14 thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to
requit it with thi hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou
art the helper of the fatherless.

10:15 break thou the arm of the wick and the evil man: seek out his
wicked till thou find none.

10:16 the lord is king for ever and ever: the heathen are perish out
of hi land.

10:17 lord, thou hast heard the desir of the humble: thou wilt
prepar their heart, thou wilt caus thine ear to hear:

10:18 To judg the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the
earth may no more oppress.



11:1 In the lord put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, flee as a bird
to your mountain?

11:2 for, lo, the wick bend their bow, they make readi their arrow
upon the string, that they may privili shoot at the upright in heart.

11:3 If the foundat be destroyed, what can the righteou do?

11:4 the lord is in hi holi temple, the lord' throne is in heaven:
hi eye behold, hi eyelid try, the children of men.

11:5 the lord trieth the righteous: but the wick and him that loveth
viol hi soul hateth.

11:6 upon the wick he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an
horr tempest: thi shall be the portion of their cup.

11:7 for the righteou lord loveth righteousness; hi counten doth
behold the upright.



12:1 help, lord; for the godli man ceaseth; for the faith fail from
among the children of men.

12:2 they speak vaniti everi one with hi neighbour: with flattering
lip and with a doubl heart do they speak.

12:3 the lord shall cut off all flatter lips, and the tongu that
speaketh proud things:

12:4 who have said, with our tongu will we prevail; our lip are our
own: who is lord over us?

12:5 for the oppress of the poor, for the sigh of the needy, now
wil I arise, saith the lord; I will set him in safeti from him that
puffeth at him.

12:6 the word of the lord are pure words: as silver tri in a
furnac of earth, purifi seven times.

12:7 thou shalt keep them, O lord, thou shalt preserv them from this
gener for ever.

12:8 the wick walk on everi side, when the vilest men are exalted.



13:1 how long wilt thou forget me, O lord? for ever? how long wilt
thou hide thi face from me?

13:2 how long shall I take counsel in my soul, have sorrow in my
heart daily? how long shall mine enemi be exalt over me?

13:3 consid and hear me, O lord my god: lighten mine eyes, lest i
sleep the sleep of death;

13:4 lest mine enemi say, I have prevail against him; and those that
troubl me rejoic when I am moved.

13:5 but I have trust in thi mercy; my heart shall rejoic in thy
salvation.

13:6 I will sing unto the lord, becaus he hath dealt bounti with
me.



14:1 the fool hath said in hi heart, there is no god. they are
corrupt, they have done abomin works, there is none that doeth
good.

14:2 the lord look down from heaven upon the children of men, to see
if there were ani that did understand, and seek god.

14:3 they are all gone aside, they are all togeth becom filthy:
ther is none that doeth good, no, not one.

14:4 have all the worker of iniqu no knowledge? who eat up my
peopl as they eat bread, and call not upon the lord.

14:5 there were they in great fear: for god is in the gener of
th righteous.

14:6 Ye have shame the counsel of the poor, becaus the lord is his
refuge.

14:7 Oh that the salvat of israel were come out of zion! when the
lord bringeth back the captiv of hi people, jacob shall rejoice,
and israel shall be glad.



15:1 lord, who shall abid in thi tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy
holi hill?

15:2 He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and
speaketh the truth in hi heart.

15:3 He that backbiteth not with hi tongue, nor doeth evil to his
neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against hi neighbour.

15:4 In whose eye a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them
that fear the lord. He that sweareth to hi own hurt, and changeth
not.

15:5 He that putteth not out hi money to usury, nor taketh reward
against the innocent. He that doeth these thing shall never be moved.



16:1 preserv me, O god: for in thee do I put my trust.

16:2 O my soul, thou hast said unto the lord, thou art my lord: my
good extendeth not to thee;

16:3 but to the saint that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in
whom is all my delight.

16:4 their sorrow shall be multipli that hasten after anoth god:
their drink offer of blood will I not offer, nor take up their
nam into my lips.

16:5 the lord is the portion of mine inherit and of my cup: thou
maintainest my lot.

16:6 the line are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a
goodli heritage.

16:7 I will bless the lord, who hath given me counsel: my rein also
instruct me in the night seasons.

16:8 I have set the lord alway befor me: becaus he is at my right
hand, I shall not be moved.

16:9 therefor my heart is glad, and my glori rejoiceth: my flesh also
shal rest in hope.

16:10 for thou wilt not leav my soul in hell; neither wilt thou
suff thine holi one to see corruption.

16:11 thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thi presenc is fulness
of joy; at thi right hand there are pleasur for evermore.



17:1 hear the right, O lord, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my
prayer, that goeth not out of feign lips.

17:2 let my sentenc come forth from thi presence; let thine eyes
behold the thing that are equal.

17:3 thou hast prove mine heart; thou hast visit me in the night;
thou hast tri me, and shalt find nothing; I am purpos that my
mouth shall not transgress.

17:4 concern the work of men, by the word of thi lip I have kept
m from the path of the destroyer.

17:5 hold up my go in thi paths, that my footstep slip not.

17:6 I have call upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O god: incline
thin ear unto me, and hear my speech.

17:7 shew thi marvel lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy
right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up
against them.

17:8 keep me as the appl of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy
wings,

17:9 from the wick that oppress me, from my deadli enemies, who
compass me about.

17:10 they are inclos in their own fat: with their mouth they speak
proudly.

17:11 they have now compass us in our steps: they have set their
ey bow down to the earth;

17:12 like as a lion that is greedi of hi prey, and as it were a
young lion lurk in secret places.

17:13 arise, O lord, disappoint him, cast him down: deliv my soul
from the wicked, which is thi sword:

17:14 from men which are thi hand, O lord, from men of the world,
which have their portion in thi life, and whose belli thou fillest
with thi hid treasure: they are full of children, and leav the rest
of their substanc to their babes.

17:15 As for me, I will behold thi face in righteousness: I shall be
satisfied, when I awake, with thi likeness.



18:1 I will love thee, O lord, my strength.

18:2 the lord is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my god,
mi strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my
salvation, and my high tower.

18:3 I will call upon the lord, who is worthi to be praised: so shall
i be save from mine enemies.

18:4 the sorrow of death compass me, and the flood of ungodli men
mad me afraid.

18:5 the sorrow of hell compass me about: the snare of death
prev me.

18:6 In my distress I call upon the lord, and cri unto my god: he
heard my voic out of hi temple, and my cri came befor him, even
into hi ears.

18:7 then the earth shook and trembled; the foundat also of the
hil move and were shaken, becaus he wa wroth.

18:8 there went up a smoke out of hi nostrils, and fire out of his
mouth devoured: coal were kindl by it.

18:9 He bow the heaven also, and came down: and dark wa under
hi feet.

18:10 and he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fli upon the
w of the wind.

18:11 He made dark hi secret place; hi pavilion round about him
wer dark water and thick cloud of the skies.

18:12 At the bright that wa befor him hi thick cloud passed,
hail stone and coal of fire.

18:13 the lord also thunder in the heavens, and the highest gave his
voice; hail stone and coal of fire.

18:14 yea, he sent out hi arrows, and scatter them; and he shot out
lightnings, and discomfit them.

18:15 then the channel of water were seen, and the foundat of
th world were discov at thi rebuke, O lord, at the blast of the
breath of thi nostrils.

18:16 He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of mani waters.

18:17 He deliv me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated
me: for they were too strong for me.

18:18 they prevent me in the day of my calamity: but the lord wa my
stay.

18:19 He brought me forth also into a larg place; he deliv me,
becaus he delight in me.

18:20 the lord reward me accord to my righteousness; accord to
th clean of my hand hath he recompens me.

18:21 for I have kept the way of the lord, and have not wickedly
depart from my god.

18:22 for all hi judgment were befor me, and I did not put away his
statut from me.

18:23 I wa also upright befor him, and I kept myself from mine
iniquity.

18:24 therefor hath the lord recompens me accord to my
righteousness, accord to the clean of my hand in hi eyesight.

18:25 with the merci thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an
upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

18:26 with the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward
th wilt shew thyself froward.

18:27 for thou wilt save the afflict people; but wilt bring down
high looks.

18:28 for thou wilt light my candle: the lord my god will enlighten my
darkness.

18:29 for by thee I have run through a troop; and by my god have i
leap over a wall.

18:30 As for god, hi way is perfect: the word of the lord is tried:
h is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

18:31 for who is god save the lord? or who is a rock save our god?

18:32 It is god that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way
perfect.

18:33 He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high
places.

18:34 He teacheth my hand to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by
min arms.

18:35 thou hast also given me the shield of thi salvation: and thy
right hand hath holden me up, and thi gentl hath made me great.

18:36 thou hast enlarg my step under me, that my feet did not slip.

18:37 I have pursu mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did i
turn again till they were consumed.

18:38 I have wound them that they were not abl to rise: they are
fallen under my feet.

18:39 for thou hast gird me with strength unto the battle: thou hast
subdu under me those that rose up against me.

18:40 thou hast also given me the neck of mine enemies; that I might
destroy them that hate me.

18:41 they cried, but there wa none to save them: even unto the lord,
but he answer them not.

18:42 then did I beat them small as the dust befor the wind: I did
cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

18:43 thou hast deliv me from the strive of the people; and
thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a peopl whom I have not
known shall serv me.

18:44 As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers
shal submit themselv unto me.

18:45 the stranger shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close
places.

18:46 the lord liveth; and bless be my rock; and let the god of my
salv be exalted.

18:47 It is god that avengeth me, and subdueth the peopl under me.

18:48 He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up
abov those that rise up against me: thou hast deliv me from the
viol man.

18:49 therefor will I give thank unto thee, O lord, among the
heathen, and sing prais unto thi name.

18:50 great deliver giveth he to hi king; and sheweth merci to
hi anointed, to david, and to hi seed for evermore.



19:1 the heaven declar the glori of god; and the firmament sheweth
hi handywork.

19:2 day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth
knowledge.

19:3 there is no speech nor language, where their voic is not heard.

19:4 their line is gone out through all the earth, and their word to
th end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacl for the sun,

19:5 which is as a bridegroom come out of hi chamber, and rejoiceth
a a strong man to run a race.

19:6 hi go forth is from the end of the heaven, and hi circuit
unto the end of it: and there is noth hid from the heat thereof.

19:7 the law of the lord is perfect, convert the soul: the
testimoni of the lord is sure, make wise the simple.

19:8 the statut of the lord are right, rejoic the heart: the
command of the lord is pure, enlighten the eyes.

19:9 the fear of the lord is clean, endur for ever: the judgments
of the lord are true and righteou altogether.

19:10 more to be desir are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold:
sweet also than honey and the honeycomb.

19:11 moreov by them is thi servant warned: and in keep of them
ther is great reward.

19:12 who can understand hi errors? cleans thou me from secret
faults.

19:13 keep back thi servant also from presumptu sins; let them not
hav dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be
innoc from the great transgression.

19:14 let the word of my mouth, and the medit of my heart, be
accept in thi sight, O lord, my strength, and my redeemer.



20:1 the lord hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the god of
jacob defend thee;

20:2 send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of
zion;

20:3 rememb all thi offerings, and accept thi burnt sacrifice;
selah.

20:4 grant thee accord to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy
counsel.

20:5 We will rejoic in thi salvation, and in the name of our god we
wil set up our banners: the lord fulfil all thi petitions.

20:6 now know I that the lord saveth hi anointed; he will hear him
from hi holi heaven with the save strength of hi right hand.

20:7 some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember
th name of the lord our god.

20:8 they are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand
upright.

20:9 save, lord: let the king hear us when we call.



21:1 the king shall joy in thi strength, O lord; and in thi salvation
how greatli shall he rejoice!

21:2 thou hast given him hi heart' desire, and hast not withholden
th request of hi lips. selah.

21:3 for thou preventest him with the bless of goodness: thou
settest a crown of pure gold on hi head.

21:4 He ask life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of
day for ever and ever.

21:5 hi glori is great in thi salvation: honour and majesti hast thou
laid upon him.

21:6 for thou hast made him most bless for ever: thou hast made him
exceed glad with thi countenance.

21:7 for the king trusteth in the lord, and through the merci of the
most high he shall not be moved.

21:8 thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thi right hand shall
find out those that hate thee.

21:9 thou shalt make them as a fieri oven in the time of thine anger:
th lord shall swallow them up in hi wrath, and the fire shall devour
them.

21:10 their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed
from among the children of men.

21:11 for they intend evil against thee: they imagin a mischievous
device, which they are not abl to perform.

21:12 therefor shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt
mak readi thine arrow upon thi string against the face of them.

21:13 Be thou exalted, lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing
and prais thi power.



22:1 My god, my god, whi hast thou forsaken me? whi art thou so far
from help me, and from the word of my roaring?

22:2 O my god, I cri in the day time, but thou hearest not; and in the
night season, and am not silent.

22:3 but thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the prais of israel.

22:4 our father trust in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver
them.

22:5 they cri unto thee, and were delivered: they trust in thee,
and were not confounded.

22:6 but I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despis of
th people.

22:7 all they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip,
they shake the head, saying,

22:8 He trust on the lord that he would deliv him: let him deliver
him, see he delight in him.

22:9 but thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me
hop when I wa upon my mother' breasts.

22:10 I wa cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my god from my
mother' belly.

22:11 Be not far from me; for troubl is near; for there is none to
help.

22:12 mani bull have compass me: strong bull of bashan have beset
m round.

22:13 they gape upon me with their mouths, as a raven and a
roar lion.

22:14 I am pour out like water, and all my bone are out of joint:
mi heart is like wax; it is melt in the midst of my bowels.

22:15 My strength is dri up like a potsherd; and my tongu cleaveth
to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

22:16 for dog have compass me: the assembl of the wick have
inclos me: they pierc my hand and my feet.

22:17 I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

22:18 they part my garment among them, and cast lot upon my vesture.

22:19 but be not thou far from me, O lord: O my strength, hast thee
to help me.

22:20 deliv my soul from the sword; my darl from the power of the
dog.

22:21 save me from the lion' mouth: for thou hast heard me from the
horn of the unicorns.

22:22 I will declar thi name unto my brethren: in the midst of the
congreg will I prais thee.

22:23 Ye that fear the lord, prais him; all ye the seed of jacob,
glorifi him; and fear him, all ye the seed of israel.

22:24 for he hath not despis nor abhor the afflict of the
afflicted; neither hath he hid hi face from him; but when he cried
unto him, he heard.

22:25 My prais shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay
mi vow befor them that fear him.

22:26 the meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall prais the lord
that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

22:27 all the end of the world shall rememb and turn unto the lord:
and all the kindr of the nation shall worship befor thee.

22:28 for the kingdom is the lord's: and he is the governor among the
nations.

22:29 all they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they
that go down to the dust shall bow befor him: and none can keep alive
hi own soul.

22:30 A seed shall serv him; it shall be account to the lord for a
generation.

22:31 they shall come, and shall declar hi righteous unto a
peopl that shall be born, that he hath done this.



23:1 the lord is my shepherd; I shall not want.

23:2 He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside
th still waters.

23:3 He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the path of righteousness
for hi name' sake.

23:4 yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, i
wil fear no evil: for thou art with me; thi rod and thi staff they
comfort me.

23:5 thou preparest a tabl befor me in the presenc of mine enemies:
th anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

23:6 sure good and merci shall follow me all the day of my
life: and I will dwell in the hous of the lord for ever.



24:1 the earth is the lord's, and the ful thereof; the world, and
they that dwell therein.

24:2 for he hath found it upon the seas, and establish it upon the
floods.

24:3 who shall ascend into the hill of the lord? or who shall stand in
hi holi place?

24:4 He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted
up hi soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

24:5 He shall receiv the bless from the lord, and righteousness
from the god of hi salvation.

24:6 thi is the gener of them that seek him, that seek thi face,
o jacob. selah.

24:7 lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting
doors; and the king of glori shall come in.

24:8 who is thi king of glory? the lord strong and mighty, the lord
mighti in battle.

24:9 lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting
doors; and the king of glori shall come in.

24:10 who is thi king of glory? the lord of hosts, he is the king of
glory. selah.



25:1 unto thee, O lord, do I lift up my soul.

25:2 O my god, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine
enemi triumph over me.

25:3 yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed
which transgress without cause.

25:4 shew me thi ways, O lord; teach me thi paths.

25:5 lead me in thi truth, and teach me: for thou art the god of my
salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.

25:6 remember, O lord, thi tender merci and thi lovingkindnesses;
for they have been ever of old.

25:7 rememb not the sin of my youth, nor my transgressions:
accord to thi merci rememb thou me for thi goodness' sake, o
lord.

25:8 good and upright is the lord: therefor will he teach sinner in
th way.

25:9 the meek will he guid in judgment: and the meek will he teach
hi way.

25:10 all the path of the lord are merci and truth unto such as keep
hi coven and hi testimonies.

25:11 for thi name' sake, O lord, pardon mine iniquity; for it is
great.

25:12 what man is he that feareth the lord? him shall he teach in the
way that he shall choose.

25:13 hi soul shall dwell at ease; and hi seed shall inherit the
earth.

25:14 the secret of the lord is with them that fear him; and he will
shew them hi covenant.

25:15 mine eye are ever toward the lord; for he shall pluck my feet
out of the net.

25:16 turn thee unto me, and have merci upon me; for I am desol and
afflicted.

25:17 the troubl of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my
distresses.

25:18 look upon mine afflict and my pain; and forgiv all my sins.

25:19 consid mine enemies; for they are many; and they hate me with
cruel hatred.

25:20 O keep my soul, and deliv me: let me not be ashamed; for I put
mi trust in thee.

25:21 let integr and upright preserv me; for I wait on thee.

25:22 redeem israel, O god, out of all hi troubles.



26:1 judg me, O lord; for I have walk in mine integrity: I have
trust also in the lord; therefor I shall not slide.

26:2 examin me, O lord, and prove me; tri my rein and my heart.

26:3 for thi lovingkind is befor mine eyes: and I have walk in
thi truth.

26:4 I have not sat with vain persons, neither will I go in with
dissemblers.

26:5 I have hate the congreg of evil doers; and will not sit
with the wicked.

26:6 I will wash mine hand in innocency: so will I compass thine
altar, O lord:

26:7 that I may publish with the voic of thanksgiving, and tell of
al thi wondrou works.

26:8 lord, I have love the habit of thi house, and the place
wher thine honour dwelleth.

26:9 gather not my soul with sinners, nor my life with bloodi men:

26:10 In whose hand is mischief, and their right hand is full of
bribes.

26:11 but as for me, I will walk in mine integrity: redeem me, and be
merci unto me.

26:12 My foot standeth in an even place: in the congreg will i
bless the lord.



27:1 the lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the
lord is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?

27:2 when the wicked, even mine enemi and my foes, came upon me to
eat up my flesh, they stumbl and fell.

27:3 though an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear:
though war should rise against me, in thi will I be confident.

27:4 one thing have I desir of the lord, that will I seek after;
that I may dwell in the hous of the lord all the day of my life, to
behold the beauti of the lord, and to enquir in hi temple.

27:5 for in the time of troubl he shall hide me in hi pavilion: in
th secret of hi tabernacl shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon
a rock.

27:6 and now shall mine head be lift up abov mine enemi round
about me: therefor will I offer in hi tabernacl sacrific of joy;
i will sing, yea, I will sing prais unto the lord.

27:7 hear, O lord, when I cri with my voice: have merci also upon me,
and answer me.

27:8 when thou saidst, seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, thy
face, lord, will I seek.

27:9 hide not thi face far from me; put not thi servant away in anger:
th hast been my help; leav me not, neither forsak me, O god of my
salvation.

27:10 when my father and my mother forsak me, then the lord will take
m up.

27:11 teach me thi way, O lord, and lead me in a plain path, because
of mine enemies.

27:12 deliv me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false
wit are risen up against me, and such as breath out cruelty.

27:13 I had fainted, unless I had believ to see the good of the
lord in the land of the living.

27:14 wait on the lord: be of good courage, and he shall strengthen
thin heart: wait, I say, on the lord.



28:1 unto thee will I cry, O lord my rock; be not silent to me: lest,
if thou be silent to me, I becom like them that go down into the pit.

28:2 hear the voic of my supplications, when I cri unto thee, when i
lift up my hand toward thi holi oracle.

28:3 draw me not away with the wicked, and with the worker of
iniquity, which speak peac to their neighbours, but mischief is in
their hearts.

28:4 give them accord to their deeds, and accord to the
wicked of their endeavours: give them after the work of their
hands; render to them their desert.

28:5 becaus they regard not the work of the lord, nor the operation
of hi hands, he shall destroy them, and not build them up.

28:6 bless be the lord, becaus he hath heard the voic of my
supplications.

28:7 the lord is my strength and my shield; my heart trust in him,
and I am helped: therefor my heart greatli rejoiceth; and with my
song will I prais him.

28:8 the lord is their strength, and he is the save strength of his
anointed.

28:9 save thi people, and bless thine inheritance: feed them also, and
lift them up for ever.



29:1 give unto the lord, O ye mighty, give unto the lord glori and
strength.

29:2 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name; worship the lord
in the beauti of holiness.

29:3 the voic of the lord is upon the waters: the god of glory
thundereth: the lord is upon mani waters.

29:4 the voic of the lord is powerful; the voic of the lord is full
of majesty.

29:5 the voic of the lord breaketh the cedars; yea, the lord breaketh
th cedar of lebanon.

29:6 He maketh them also to skip like a calf; lebanon and sirion like
a young unicorn.

29:7 the voic of the lord divideth the flame of fire.

29:8 the voic of the lord shaketh the wilderness; the lord shaketh
th wilder of kadesh.

29:9 the voic of the lord maketh the hind to calve, and discovereth
th forests: and in hi templ doth everi one speak of hi glory.

29:10 the lord sitteth upon the flood; yea, the lord sitteth king for
ever.

29:11 the lord will give strength unto hi people; the lord will bless
hi peopl with peace.



30:1 I will extol thee, O lord; for thou hast lift me up, and hast
not made my foe to rejoic over me.

30:2 O lord my god, I cri unto thee, and thou hast heal me.

30:3 O lord, thou hast brought up my soul from the grave: thou hast
kept me alive, that I should not go down to the pit.

30:4 sing unto the lord, O ye saint of his, and give thank at the
remembr of hi holiness.

30:5 for hi anger endureth but a moment; in hi favour is life:
weep may endur for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.

30:6 and in my prosper I said, I shall never be moved.

30:7 lord, by thi favour thou hast made my mountain to stand strong:
thou didst hide thi face, and I wa troubled.

30:8 I cri to thee, O lord; and unto the lord I made supplication.

30:9 what profit is there in my blood, when I go down to the pit?
shal the dust prais thee? shall it declar thi truth?

30:10 hear, O lord, and have merci upon me: lord, be thou my helper.

30:11 thou hast turn for me my mourn into dancing: thou hast put
off my sackcloth, and gird me with gladness;

30:12 To the end that my glori may sing prais to thee, and not be
silent.

o lord my god, I will give thank unto thee for ever.



31:1 In thee, O lord, do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed:
deliv me in thi righteousness.

31:2 bow down thine ear to me; deliv me speedily: be thou my strong
rock, for an hous of defenc to save me.

31:3 for thou art my rock and my fortress; therefor for thi name's
sak lead me, and guid me.

31:4 pull me out of the net that they have laid privili for me: for
thou art my strength.

31:5 into thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeem me, O lord
god of truth.

31:6 I have hate them that regard lie vanities: but I trust in the
lord.

31:7 I will be glad and rejoic in thi mercy: for thou hast considered
mi trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;

31:8 and hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set
mi feet in a larg room.

31:9 have merci upon me, O lord, for I am in trouble: mine eye is
consum with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.

31:10 for my life is spent with grief, and my year with sighing: my
strength faileth becaus of mine iniquity, and my bone are consumed.

31:11 I wa a reproach among all mine enemies, but especi among my
neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me
without fled from me.

31:12 I am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken
vessel.

31:13 for I have heard the slander of many: fear wa on everi side:
whil they took counsel togeth against me, they devis to take away
mi life.

31:14 but I trust in thee, O lord: I said, thou art my god.

31:15 My time are in thi hand: deliv me from the hand of mine
enemies, and from them that persecut me.

31:16 make thi face to shine upon thi servant: save me for thy
mercies' sake.

31:17 let me not be ashamed, O lord; for I have call upon thee: let
th wick be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.

31:18 let the lie lip be put to silence; which speak grievous
th proudli and contemptu against the righteous.

31:19 Oh how great is thi goodness, which thou hast laid up for them
that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee
befor the son of men!

31:20 thou shalt hide them in the secret of thi presenc from the
prid of man: thou shalt keep them secretli in a pavilion from the
strif of tongues.

31:21 bless be the lord: for he hath shew me hi marvellous
kind in a strong city.

31:22 for I said in my haste, I am cut off from befor thine eyes:
nevertheless thou heardest the voic of my supplic when I cried
unto thee.

31:23 O love the lord, all ye hi saints: for the lord preserveth the
faithful, and plenti rewardeth the proud doer.

31:24 Be of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye
that hope in the lord.



32:1 bless is he whose transgress is forgiven, whose sin is
covered.

32:2 bless is the man unto whom the lord imputeth not iniquity, and
in whose spirit there is no guile.

32:3 when I kept silence, my bone wax old through my roar all
th day long.

32:4 for day and night thi hand wa heavi upon me: my moistur is
turn into the drought of summer. selah.

32:5 I acknowledg my sin unto thee, and mine iniqu have I not hid.
i said, I will confess my transgress unto the lord; and thou
forgavest the iniqu of my sin. selah.

32:6 for thi shall everi one that is godli pray unto thee in a time
when thou mayest be found: sure in the flood of great water they
shal not come nigh unto him.

32:7 thou art my hide place; thou shalt preserv me from trouble;
th shalt compass me about with song of deliverance. selah.

32:8 I will instruct thee and teach thee in the way which thou shalt
go: I will guid thee with mine eye.

32:9 Be ye not as the horse, or as the mule, which have no
understanding: whose mouth must be held in with bit and bridle, lest
they come near unto thee.

32:10 mani sorrow shall be to the wicked: but he that trusteth in the
lord, merci shall compass him about.

32:11 Be glad in the lord, and rejoice, ye righteous: and shout for
joy, all ye that are upright in heart.



33:1 rejoic in the lord, O ye righteous: for prais is come for the
upright.

33:2 prais the lord with harp: sing unto him with the psalteri and an
instru of ten strings.

33:3 sing unto him a new song; play skil with a loud noise.

33:4 for the word of the lord is right; and all hi work are done in
truth.

33:5 He loveth righteous and judgment: the earth is full of the
good of the lord.

33:6 By the word of the lord were the heaven made; and all the host
of them by the breath of hi mouth.

33:7 He gathereth the water of the sea togeth as an heap: he layeth
up the depth in storehouses.

33:8 let all the earth fear the lord: let all the inhabit of the
world stand in awe of him.

33:9 for he spake, and it wa done; he commanded, and it stood fast.

33:10 the lord bringeth the counsel of the heathen to nought: he
maketh the devic of the peopl of none effect.

33:11 the counsel of the lord standeth for ever, the thought of his
heart to all generations.

33:12 bless is the nation whose god is the lord; and the peopl whom
h hath chosen for hi own inheritance.

33:13 the lord looketh from heaven; he beholdeth all the son of men.

33:14 from the place of hi habit he looketh upon all the
inhabit of the earth.

33:15 He fashioneth their heart alike; he considereth all their
works.

33:16 there is no king save by the multitud of an host: a mighti man
i not deliv by much strength.

33:17 An hors is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver
ani by hi great strength.

33:18 behold, the eye of the lord is upon them that fear him, upon
them that hope in hi mercy;

33:19 To deliv their soul from death, and to keep them aliv in
famine.

33:20 our soul waiteth for the lord: he is our help and our shield.

33:21 for our heart shall rejoic in him, becaus we have trust in
hi holi name.

33:22 let thi mercy, O lord, be upon us, accord as we hope in thee.



34:1 I will bless the lord at all times: hi prais shall continually
b in my mouth.

34:2 My soul shall make her boast in the lord: the humbl shall hear
thereof, and be glad.

34:3 O magnifi the lord with me, and let us exalt hi name together.

34:4 I sought the lord, and he heard me, and deliv me from all my
fears.

34:5 they look unto him, and were lightened: and their face were
not ashamed.

34:6 thi poor man cried, and the lord heard him, and save him out of
al hi troubles.

34:7 the angel of the lord encampeth round about them that fear him,
and delivereth them.

34:8 O tast and see that the lord is good: bless is the man that
trusteth in him.

34:9 O fear the lord, ye hi saints: for there is no want to them that
fear him.

34:10 the young lion do lack, and suffer hunger: but they that seek
th lord shall not want ani good thing.

34:11 come, ye children, hearken unto me: I will teach you the fear of
th lord.

34:12 what man is he that desireth life, and loveth mani days, that he
may see good?

34:13 keep thi tongu from evil, and thi lip from speak guile.

34:14 depart from evil, and do good; seek peace, and pursu it.

34:15 the eye of the lord are upon the righteous, and hi ear are
open unto their cry.

34:16 the face of the lord is against them that do evil, to cut off
th remembr of them from the earth.

34:17 the righteou cry, and the lord heareth, and delivereth them out
of all their troubles.

34:18 the lord is nigh unto them that are of a broken heart; and
saveth such as be of a contrit spirit.

34:19 mani are the afflict of the righteous: but the lord
delivereth him out of them all.

34:20 He keepeth all hi bones: not one of them is broken.

34:21 evil shall slay the wicked: and they that hate the righteous
shal be desolate.

34:22 the lord redeemeth the soul of hi servants: and none of them
that trust in him shall be desolate.



35:1 plead my cause, O lord, with them that strive with me: fight
against them that fight against me.

35:2 take hold of shield and buckler, and stand up for mine help.

35:3 draw out also the spear, and stop the way against them that
persecut me: say unto my soul, I am thi salvation.

35:4 let them be confound and put to shame that seek after my soul:
let them be turn back and brought to confus that devis my hurt.

35:5 let them be as chaff befor the wind: and let the angel of the
lord chase them.

35:6 let their way be dark and slippery: and let the angel of the lord
persecut them.

35:7 for without caus have they hid for me their net in a pit, which
without caus they have dig for my soul.

35:8 let destruct come upon him at unawares; and let hi net that
h hath hid catch himself: into that veri destruct let him fall.

35:9 and my soul shall be joy in the lord: it shall rejoic in his
salvation.

35:10 all my bone shall say, lord, who is like unto thee, which
deliverest the poor from him that is too strong for him, yea, the poor
and the needi from him that spoileth him?

35:11 fals wit did rise up; they laid to my charg thing that
i knew not.

35:12 they reward me evil for good to the spoil of my soul.

35:13 but as for me, when they were sick, my cloth wa sackcloth: i
humbl my soul with fasting; and my prayer return into mine own
bosom.

35:14 I behav myself as though he had been my friend or brother: i
bow down heavily, as one that mourneth for hi mother.

35:15 but in mine advers they rejoiced, and gather themselves
together: yea, the abject gather themselv togeth against me,
and I knew it not; they did tear me, and ceas not:

35:16 with hypocrit mocker in feasts, they gnash upon me with
their teeth.

35:17 lord, how long wilt thou look on? rescu my soul from their
destructions, my darl from the lions.

35:18 I will give thee thank in the great congregation: I will praise
the among much people.

35:19 let not them that are mine enemi wrong rejoic over me:
neith let them wink with the eye that hate me without a cause.

35:20 for they speak not peace: but they devis deceit matters
against them that are quiet in the land.

35:21 yea, they open their mouth wide against me, and said, aha,
aha, our eye hath seen it.

35:22 thi thou hast seen, O lord: keep not silence: O lord, be not
far from me.

35:23 stir up thyself, and awak to my judgment, even unto my cause,
mi god and my lord.

35:24 judg me, O lord my god, accord to thi righteousness; and let
them not rejoic over me.

35:25 let them not say in their hearts, ah, so would we have it: let
them not say, We have swallow him up.

35:26 let them be asham and brought to confus togeth that
rejoic at mine hurt: let them be cloth with shame and dishonour
that magnifi themselv against me.

35:27 let them shout for joy, and be glad, that favour my righteous
cause: yea, let them say continually, let the lord be magnified, which
hath pleasur in the prosper of hi servant.

35:28 and my tongu shall speak of thi righteous and of thi praise
al the day long.



36:1 the transgress of the wick saith within my heart, that there
i no fear of god befor hi eyes.

36:2 for he flattereth himself in hi own eyes, until hi iniqu be
found to be hateful.

36:3 the word of hi mouth are iniqu and deceit: he hath left off
to be wise, and to do good.

36:4 He deviseth mischief upon hi bed; he setteth himself in a way
that is not good; he abhorreth not evil.

36:5 thi mercy, O lord, is in the heavens; and thi faithfulness
reacheth unto the clouds.

36:6 thi righteous is like the great mountains; thi judgment are
a great deep: O lord, thou preservest man and beast.

36:7 how excel is thi lovingkindness, O god! therefor the
children of men put their trust under the shadow of thi wings.

36:8 they shall be abundantli satisfi with the fat of thi house;
and thou shalt make them drink of the river of thi pleasures.

36:9 for with thee is the fountain of life: in thi light shall we see
light.

36:10 O continu thi lovingkind unto them that know thee; and thy
right to the upright in heart.

36:11 let not the foot of pride come against me, and let not the hand
of the wick remov me.

36:12 there are the worker of iniqu fallen: they are cast down,
and shall not be abl to rise.



37:1 fret not thyself becaus of evildoers, neither be thou envious
against the worker of iniquity.

37:2 for they shall soon be cut down like the grass, and wither as the
green herb.

37:3 trust in the lord, and do good; so shalt thou dwell in the land,
and verili thou shalt be fed.

37:4 delight thyself also in the lord: and he shall give thee the
desir of thine heart.

37:5 commit thi way unto the lord; trust also in him; and he shall
br it to pass.

37:6 and he shall bring forth thi righteous as the light, and thy
judg as the noonday.

37:7 rest in the lord, and wait patient for him: fret not thyself
becaus of him who prospereth in hi way, becaus of the man who
bringeth wick devic to pass.

37:8 ceas from anger, and forsak wrath: fret not thyself in ani wise
to do evil.

37:9 for evildo shall be cut off: but those that wait upon the
lord, they shall inherit the earth.

37:10 for yet a littl while, and the wick shall not be: yea, thou
shalt dilig consid hi place, and it shall not be.

37:11 but the meek shall inherit the earth; and shall delight
themselv in the abund of peace.

37:12 the wick plotteth against the just, and gnasheth upon him with
hi teeth.

37:13 the lord shall laugh at him: for he seeth that hi day is
coming.

37:14 the wick have drawn out the sword, and have bent their bow, to
cast down the poor and needy, and to slay such as be of upright
conversation.

37:15 their sword shall enter into their own heart, and their bows
shal be broken.

37:16 A littl that a righteou man hath is better than the rich of
mani wicked.

37:17 for the arm of the wick shall be broken: but the lord
upholdeth the righteous.

37:18 the lord knoweth the day of the upright: and their inheritance
shal be for ever.

37:19 they shall not be asham in the evil time: and in the day of
famin they shall be satisfied.

37:20 but the wick shall perish, and the enemi of the lord shall
b as the fat of lambs: they shall consume; into smoke shall they
consum away.

37:21 the wick borroweth, and payeth not again: but the righteous
sheweth mercy, and giveth.

37:22 for such as be bless of him shall inherit the earth; and they
that be curs of him shall be cut off.

37:23 the step of a good man are order by the lord: and he
delighteth in hi way.

37:24 though he fall, he shall not be utterli cast down: for the lord
upholdeth him with hi hand.

37:25 I have been young, and now am old; yet have I not seen the
right forsaken, nor hi seed beg bread.

37:26 He is ever merciful, and lendeth; and hi seed is blessed.

37:27 depart from evil, and do good; and dwell for evermore.

37:28 for the lord loveth judgment, and forsaketh not hi saints; they
ar preserv for ever: but the seed of the wick shall be cut off.

37:29 the righteou shall inherit the land, and dwell therein for
ever.

37:30 the mouth of the righteou speaketh wisdom, and hi tongue
talketh of judgment.

37:31 the law of hi god is in hi heart; none of hi step shall
slide.

37:32 the wick watcheth the righteous, and seeketh to slay him.

37:33 the lord will not leav him in hi hand, nor condemn him when he
i judged.

37:34 wait on the lord, and keep hi way, and he shall exalt thee to
inherit the land: when the wick are cut off, thou shalt see it.

37:35 I have seen the wick in great power, and spread himself
lik a green bay tree.

37:36 yet he pass away, and, lo, he wa not: yea, I sought him, but
h could not be found.

37:37 mark the perfect man, and behold the upright: for the end of
that man is peace.

37:38 but the transgressor shall be destroy together: the end of
th wick shall be cut off.

37:39 but the salvat of the righteou is of the lord: he is their
strength in the time of trouble.

37:40 and the lord shall help them, and deliv them: he shall deliver
them from the wicked, and save them, becaus they trust in him.



38:1 O lord, rebuk me not in thi wrath: neither chasten me in thi hot
displeasure.

38:2 for thine arrow stick fast in me, and thi hand presseth me sore.

38:3 there is no sound in my flesh becaus of thine anger; neither
i there ani rest in my bone becaus of my sin.

38:4 for mine iniqu are gone over mine head: as an heavi burden
they are too heavi for me.

38:5 My wound stink and are corrupt becaus of my foolishness.

38:6 I am troubled; I am bow down greatly; I go mourn all the day
long.

38:7 for my loin are fill with a loathsom disease: and there is no
sound in my flesh.

38:8 I am feebl and sore broken: I have roar by reason of the
disquiet of my heart.

38:9 lord, all my desir is befor thee; and my groan is not hid
from thee.

38:10 My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light of
min eyes, it also is gone from me.

38:11 My lover and my friend stand aloof from my sore; and my
kinsmen stand afar off.

38:12 they also that seek after my life lay snare for me: and they
that seek my hurt speak mischiev things, and imagin deceit all
th day long.

38:13 but I, as a deaf man, heard not; and I wa as a dumb man that
openeth not hi mouth.

38:14 thu I wa as a man that heareth not, and in whose mouth are no
reproofs.

38:15 for in thee, O lord, do I hope: thou wilt hear, O lord my god.

38:16 for I said, hear me, lest otherwis they should rejoic over me:
when my foot slippeth, they magnifi themselv against me.

38:17 for I am readi to halt, and my sorrow is continu befor me.

38:18 for I will declar mine iniquity; I will be sorri for my sin.

38:19 but mine enemi are lively, and they are strong: and they that
hat me wrong are multiplied.

38:20 they also that render evil for good are mine adversaries;
becaus I follow the thing that good is.

38:21 forsak me not, O lord: O my god, be not far from me.

38:22 make hast to help me, O lord my salvation.



39:1 I said, I will take heed to my ways, that I sin not with my
tongue: I will keep my mouth with a bridle, while the wick is before
me.

39:2 I wa dumb with silence, I held my peace, even from good; and my
sorrow wa stirred.

39:3 My heart wa hot within me, while I wa muse the fire burned:
then spake I with my tongue,

39:4 lord, make me to know mine end, and the measur of my days, what
it is: that I may know how frail I am.

39:5 behold, thou hast made my day as an handbreadth; and mine age is
a noth befor thee: verili everi man at hi best state is
altogeth vanity.

selah.

39:6 sure everi man walketh in a vain shew: sure they are
disquiet in vain: he heapeth up riches, and knoweth not who shall
gath them.

39:7 and now, lord, what wait I for? my hope is in thee.

39:8 deliv me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach
of the foolish.

39:9 I wa dumb, I open not my mouth; becaus thou didst it.

39:10 remov thi stroke away from me: I am consum by the blow of
thin hand.

39:11 when thou with rebuk dost correct man for iniquity, thou
makest hi beauti to consum away like a moth: sure everi man is
vanity. selah.

39:12 hear my prayer, O lord, and give ear unto my cry; hold not thy
peac at my tears: for I am a stranger with thee, and a sojourner, as
al my father were.

39:13 O spare me, that I may recov strength, befor I go hence, and
b no more.



40:1 I wait patient for the lord; and he inclin unto me, and
heard my cry.

40:2 He brought me up also out of an horribl pit, out of the miry
clay, and set my feet upon a rock, and establish my goings.

40:3 and he hath put a new song in my mouth, even prais unto our god:
mani shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in the lord.

40:4 bless is that man that maketh the lord hi trust, and
respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn asid to lies.

40:5 many, O lord my god, are thi wonder work which thou hast
done, and thi thought which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned
up in order unto thee: if I would declar and speak of them, they are
mor than can be numbered.

40:6 sacrific and offer thou didst not desire; mine ear hast thou
opened: burnt offer and sin offer hast thou not required.

40:7 then said I, lo, I come: in the volum of the book it is written
of me,

40:8 I delight to do thi will, O my god: yea, thi law is within my
heart.

40:9 I have preach righteous in the great congregation: lo, i
hav not refrain my lips, O lord, thou knowest.

40:10 I have not hid thi righteous within my heart; I have
declar thi faith and thi salvation: I have not conceal thy
lovingkind and thi truth from the great congregation.

40:11 withhold not thou thi tender merci from me, O lord: let thy
lovingkind and thi truth continu preserv me.

40:12 for innumer evil have compass me about: mine iniquities
hav taken hold upon me, so that I am not abl to look up; they are
mor than the hair of mine head: therefor my heart faileth me.

40:13 Be pleased, O lord, to deliv me: O lord, make hast to help
me.

40:14 let them be asham and confound togeth that seek after my
soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that
wish me evil.

40:15 let them be desol for a reward of their shame that say unto
me, aha, aha.

40:16 let all those that seek thee rejoic and be glad in thee: let
such as love thi salvat say continually, the lord be magnified.

40:17 but I am poor and needy; yet the lord thinketh upon me: thou art
mi help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my god.



41:1 bless is he that considereth the poor: the lord will deliver
him in time of trouble.

41:2 the lord will preserv him, and keep him alive; and he shall be
bless upon the earth: and thou wilt not deliv him unto the will of
hi enemies.

41:3 the lord will strengthen him upon the bed of languishing: thou
wilt make all hi bed in hi sickness.

41:4 I said, lord, be merci unto me: heal my soul; for I have
sin against thee.

41:5 mine enemi speak evil of me, when shall he die, and hi name
perish?

41:6 and if he come to see me, he speaketh vanity: hi heart gathereth
iniqu to itself; when he goeth abroad, he telleth it.

41:7 all that hate me whisper togeth against me: against me do they
devis my hurt.

41:8 An evil disease, say they, cleaveth fast unto him: and now that
h lieth he shall rise up no more.

41:9 yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did eat
of my bread, hath lift up hi heel against me.

41:10 but thou, O lord, be merci unto me, and rais me up, that i
may requit them.

41:11 By thi I know that thou favourest me, becaus mine enemi doth
not triumph over me.

41:12 and as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest
m befor thi face for ever.

41:13 bless be the lord god of israel from everlasting, and to
everlasting. amen, and amen.



42:1 As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul
aft thee, O god.

42:2 My soul thirsteth for god, for the live god: when shall I come
and appear befor god?

42:3 My tear have been my meat day and night, while they continually
say unto me, where is thi god?

42:4 when I rememb these things, I pour out my soul in me: for I had
gon with the multitude, I went with them to the hous of god, with
th voic of joy and praise, with a multitud that kept holyday.

42:5 whi art thou cast down, O my soul? and whi art thou disquiet in
me?  hope thou in god: for I shall yet prais him for the help of his
countenance.

42:6 O my god, my soul is cast down within me: therefor will i
rememb thee from the land of jordan, and of the hermonites, from the
hil mizar.

42:7 deep calleth unto deep at the nois of thi waterspouts: all thy
wav and thi billow are gone over me.

42:8 yet the lord will command hi lovingkind in the day time, and
in the night hi song shall be with me, and my prayer unto the god of
mi life.

42:9 I will say unto god my rock, whi hast thou forgotten me? whi go i
mourn becaus of the oppress of the enemy?

42:10 As with a sword in my bones, mine enemi reproach me; while
they say daili unto me, where is thi god?

42:11 whi art thou cast down, O my soul? and whi art thou disquieted
within me? hope thou in god: for I shall yet prais him, who is the
health of my countenance, and my god.



43:1 judg me, O god, and plead my caus against an ungodli nation: o
deliv me from the deceit and unjust man.

43:2 for thou art the god of my strength: whi dost thou cast me off?
whi go I mourn becaus of the oppress of the enemy?

43:3 O send out thi light and thi truth: let them lead me; let them
br me unto thi holi hill, and to thi tabernacles.

43:4 then will I go unto the altar of god, unto god my exceed joy:
yea, upon the harp will I prais thee, O god my god.

43:5 whi art thou cast down, O my soul? and whi art thou disquieted
within me? hope in god: for I shall yet prais him, who is the health
of my countenance, and my god.



44:1 We have heard with our ears, O god, our father have told us,
what work thou didst in their days, in the time of old.

44:2 how thou didst drive out the heathen with thi hand, and plantedst
them; how thou didst afflict the people, and cast them out.

44:3 for they got not the land in possess by their own sword,
neith did their own arm save them: but thi right hand, and thine
arm, and the light of thi countenance, becaus thou hadst a favour
unto them.

44:4 thou art my king, O god: command deliver for jacob.

44:5 through thee will we push down our enemies: through thi name will
w tread them under that rise up against us.

44:6 for I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.

44:7 but thou hast save us from our enemies, and hast put them to
sham that hate us.

44:8 In god we boast all the day long, and prais thi name for ever.

selah.

44:9 but thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not forth
with our armies.

44:10 thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which hate
u spoil for themselves.

44:11 thou hast given us like sheep appoint for meat; and hast
scatt us among the heathen.

44:12 thou sellest thi peopl for nought, and dost not increas thy
wealth by their price.

44:13 thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a
deris to them that are round about us.

44:14 thou makest us a byword among the heathen, a shake of the head
among the people.

44:15 My confus is continu befor me, and the shame of my face
hath cover me,

44:16 for the voic of him that reproacheth and blasphemeth; by reason
of the enemi and avenger.

44:17 all thi is come upon us; yet have we not forgotten thee,
neith have we dealt fals in thi covenant.

44:18 our heart is not turn back, neither have our step declined
from thi way;

44:19 though thou hast sore broken us in the place of dragons, and
cov us with the shadow of death.

44:20 If we have forgotten the name of our god, or stretch out our
hand to a strang god;

44:21 shall not god search thi out? for he knoweth the secret of the
heart.

44:22 yea, for thi sake are we kill all the day long; we are counted
a sheep for the slaughter.

44:23 awake, whi sleepest thou, O lord? arise, cast us not off for
ever.

44:24 wherefor hidest thou thi face, and forgettest our affliction
and our oppression?

44:25 for our soul is bow down to the dust: our belli cleaveth unto
th earth.

44:26 aris for our help, and redeem us for thi mercies' sake.



45:1 My heart is indit a good matter: I speak of the thing which i
hav made touch the king: my tongu is the pen of a readi writer.

45:2 thou art fairer than the children of men: grace is pour into
thi lips: therefor god hath bless thee for ever.

45:3 gird thi sword upon thi thigh, O most mighty, with thi glori and
thi majesty.

45:4 and in thi majesti ride prosper becaus of truth and
meek and righteousness; and thi right hand shall teach thee
terr things.

45:5 thine arrow are sharp in the heart of the king' enemies;
wherebi the peopl fall under thee.

45:6 thi throne, O god, is for ever and ever: the sceptr of thy
kingdom is a right sceptre.

45:7 thou lovest righteousness, and hatest wickedness: therefor god,
thi god, hath anoint thee with the oil of glad abov thy
fellows.

45:8 all thi garment smell of myrrh, and aloes, and cassia, out of
th ivori palaces, wherebi they have made thee glad.

45:9 kings' daughter were among thi honour women: upon thi right
hand did stand the queen in gold of ophir.

45:10 hearken, O daughter, and consider, and inclin thine ear; forget
also thine own people, and thi father' house;

45:11 So shall the king greatli desir thi beauty: for he is thi lord;
and worship thou him.

45:12 and the daughter of tyre shall be there with a gift; even the
rich among the peopl shall intreat thi favour.

45:13 the king' daughter is all gloriou within: her cloth is of
wrought gold.

45:14 she shall be brought unto the king in raiment of needlework: the
virgin her companion that follow her shall be brought unto thee.

45:15 with glad and rejoic shall they be brought: they shall
ent into the king' palace.

45:16 instead of thi father shall be thi children, whom thou mayest
mak princ in all the earth.

45:17 I will make thi name to be rememb in all generations:
therefor shall the peopl prais thee for ever and ever.



46:1 god is our refug and strength, a veri present help in trouble.

46:2 therefor will not we fear, though the earth be removed, and
though the mountain be carri into the midst of the sea;

46:3 though the water thereof roar and be troubled, though the
mountain shake with the swell thereof. selah.

46:4 there is a river, the stream whereof shall make glad the citi of
god, the holi place of the tabernacl of the most high.

46:5 god is in the midst of her; she shall not be moved: god shall
help her, and that right early.

46:6 the heathen raged, the kingdom were moved: he utter hi voice,
th earth melted.

46:7 the lord of host is with us; the god of jacob is our refuge.
selah.

46:8 come, behold the work of the lord, what desol he hath made
in the earth.

46:9 He maketh war to ceas unto the end of the earth; he breaketh
th bow, and cutteth the spear in sunder; he burneth the chariot in
th fire.

46:10 Be still, and know that I am god: I will be exalt among the
heathen, I will be exalt in the earth.

46:11 the lord of host is with us; the god of jacob is our refuge.
selah.



47:1 O clap your hands, all ye people; shout unto god with the voice
of triumph.

47:2 for the lord most high is terrible; he is a great king over all
th earth.

47:3 He shall subdu the peopl under us, and the nation under our
feet.

47:4 He shall choos our inherit for us, the excel of jacob
whom he loved. selah.

47:5 god is gone up with a shout, the lord with the sound of a
trumpet.

47:6 sing prais to god, sing praises: sing prais unto our king,
s praises.

47:7 for god is the king of all the earth: sing ye prais with
understanding.

47:8 god reigneth over the heathen: god sitteth upon the throne of his
holiness.

47:9 the princ of the peopl are gather together, even the people
of the god of abraham: for the shield of the earth belong unto god:
h is greatli exalted.



48:1 great is the lord, and greatli to be prais in the citi of our
god, in the mountain of hi holiness.

48:2 beauti for situation, the joy of the whole earth, is mount
zion, on the side of the north, the citi of the great king.

48:3 god is known in her palac for a refuge.

48:4 for, lo, the king were assembled, they pass by together.

48:5 they saw it, and so they marvelled; they were troubled, and
hast away.

48:6 fear took hold upon them there, and pain, as of a woman in
travail.

48:7 thou breakest the ship of tarshish with an east wind.

48:8 As we have heard, so have we seen in the citi of the lord of
hosts, in the citi of our god: god will establish it for ever. selah.

48:9 We have thought of thi lovingkindness, O god, in the midst of thy
temple.

48:10 accord to thi name, O god, so is thi prais unto the end of
th earth: thi right hand is full of righteousness.

48:11 let mount zion rejoice, let the daughter of judah be glad,
becaus of thi judgments.

48:12 walk about zion, and go round about her: tell the towers
thereof.

48:13 mark ye well her bulwarks, consid her palaces; that ye may
tel it to the gener following.

48:14 for thi god is our god for ever and ever: he will be our guide
even unto death.



49:1 hear this, all ye people; give ear, all ye inhabit of the
world:

49:2 both low and high, rich and poor, together.

49:3 My mouth shall speak of wisdom; and the medit of my heart
shal be of understanding.

49:4 I will inclin mine ear to a parable: I will open my dark saying
upon the harp.

49:5 wherefor should I fear in the day of evil, when the iniqu of
mi heel shall compass me about?

49:6 they that trust in their wealth, and boast themselv in the
multitud of their riches;

49:7 none of them can by ani mean redeem hi brother, nor give to god
a ransom for him:

49:8 (for the redempt of their soul is precious, and it ceaseth for
ever:)

49:9 that he should still live for ever, and not see corruption.

49:10 for he seeth that wise men die, likewis the fool and the
brutish person perish, and leav their wealth to others.

49:11 their inward thought is, that their hous shall continu for
ever, and their dwell place to all generations; they call their
land after their own names.

49:12 nevertheless man be in honour abideth not: he is like the
beast that perish.

49:13 thi their way is their folly: yet their poster approv their
sayings. selah.

49:14 like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them;
and the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning; and
their beauti shall consum in the grave from their dwelling.

49:15 but god will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he
shal receiv me. selah.

49:16 Be not thou afraid when one is made rich, when the glori of his
hous is increased;

49:17 for when he dieth he shall carri noth away: hi glori shall
not descend after him.

49:18 though while he live he bless hi soul: and men will praise
thee, when thou doest well to thyself.

49:19 He shall go to the gener of hi fathers; they shall never
se light.

49:20 man that is in honour, and understandeth not, is like the beasts
that perish.



50:1 the mighti god, even the lord, hath spoken, and call the earth
from the rise of the sun unto the go down thereof.

50:2 out of zion, the perfect of beauty, god hath shined.

50:3 our god shall come, and shall not keep silence: a fire shall
devour befor him, and it shall be veri tempestu round about him.

50:4 He shall call to the heaven from above, and to the earth, that
h may judg hi people.

50:5 gather my saint togeth unto me; those that have made a
coven with me by sacrifice.

50:6 and the heaven shall declar hi righteousness: for god is judge
himself. selah.

50:7 hear, O my people, and I will speak; O israel, and I will testify
against thee: I am god, even thi god.

50:8 I will not reprov thee for thi sacrific or thi burnt
offerings, to have been continu befor me.

50:9 I will take no bullock out of thi house, nor he goat out of thy
folds.

50:10 for everi beast of the forest is mine, and the cattl upon a
thousand hills.

50:11 I know all the fowl of the mountains: and the wild beast of
th field are mine.

50:12 If I were hungry, I would not tell thee: for the world is mine,
and the ful thereof.

50:13 will I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?

50:14 offer unto god thanksgiving; and pay thi vow unto the most
high:

50:15 and call upon me in the day of trouble: I will deliv thee, and
thou shalt glorifi me.

50:16 but unto the wick god saith, what hast thou to do to declare
mi statutes, or that thou shouldest take my coven in thi mouth?

50:17 see thou hatest instruction, and casteth my word behind
thee.

50:18 when thou sawest a thief, then thou consentedst with him, and
hast been partak with adulterers.

50:19 thou givest thi mouth to evil, and thi tongu frameth deceit.

50:20 thou sittest and speakest against thi brother; thou slanderest
thin own mother' son.

50:21 these thing hast thou done, and I kept silence; thou thoughtest
that I wa altogeth such an one as thyself: but I will reprov thee,
and set them in order befor thine eyes.

50:22 now consid this, ye that forget god, lest I tear you in
pieces, and there be none to deliver.

50:23 whoso offereth prais glorifieth me: and to him that ordereth
hi convers aright will I shew the salvat of god.



51:1 have merci upon me, O god, accord to thi lovingkindness:
accord unto the multitud of thi tender merci blot out my
transgressions.

51:2 wash me throughli from mine iniquity, and cleans me from my sin.

51:3 for I acknowledg my transgressions: and my sin is ever before
me.

51:4 against thee, thee only, have I sinned, and done thi evil in thy
