sight: that thou mightest be justifi when thou speakest, and be
clear when thou judgest.

51:5 behold, I wa shapen in iniquity; and in sin did my mother
conc me.

51:6 behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the
hidden part thou shalt make me to know wisdom.

51:7 purg me with hyssop, and I shall be clean: wash me, and I shall
b whiter than snow.

51:8 make me to hear joy and gladness; that the bone which thou hast
broken may rejoice.

51:9 hide thi face from my sins, and blot out all mine iniquities.

51:10 creat in me a clean heart, O god; and renew a right spirit
within me.

51:11 cast me not away from thi presence; and take not thi holi spirit
from me.

51:12 restor unto me the joy of thi salvation; and uphold me with thy
fre spirit.

51:13 then will I teach transgressor thi ways; and sinner shall be
convert unto thee.

51:14 deliv me from bloodguiltiness, O god, thou god of my
salvation: and my tongu shall sing aloud of thi righteousness.

51:15 O lord, open thou my lips; and my mouth shall shew forth thy
praise.

51:16 for thou desirest not sacrifice; els would I give it: thou
delightest not in burnt offering.

51:17 the sacrific of god are a broken spirit: a broken and a
contrit heart, O god, thou wilt not despise.

51:18 Do good in thi good pleasur unto zion: build thou the wall of
jerusalem.

51:19 then shalt thou be pleas with the sacrific of righteousness,
with burnt offer and whole burnt offering: then shall they offer
bullock upon thine altar.



52:1 whi boastest thou thyself in mischief, O mighti man? the goodness
of god endureth continually.

52:2 the tongu deviseth mischiefs; like a sharp razor, working
deceitfully.

52:3 thou lovest evil more than good; and lie rather than to speak
righteousness. selah.

52:4 thou lovest all devour words, O thou deceit tongue.

52:5 god shall likewis destroy thee for ever, he shall take thee
away, and pluck thee out of thi dwell place, and root thee out of
th land of the living. selah.

52:6 the righteou also shall see, and fear, and shall laugh at him:

52:7 lo, thi is the man that made not god hi strength; but trusted
in the abund of hi riches, and strengthen himself in his
wickedness.

52:8 but I am like a green oliv tree in the hous of god: I trust in
th merci of god for ever and ever.

52:9 I will prais thee for ever, becaus thou hast done it: and i
wil wait on thi name; for it is good befor thi saints.



53:1 the fool hath said in hi heart, there is no god. corrupt are
they, and have done abomin iniquity: there is none that doeth
good.

53:2 god look down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if
ther were ani that did understand, that did seek god.

53:3 everi one of them is gone back: they are altogeth become
filthy; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

53:4 have the worker of iniqu no knowledge? who eat up my people
a they eat bread: they have not call upon god.

53:5 there were they in great fear, where no fear was: for god hath
scatt the bone of him that encampeth against thee: thou hast put
them to shame, becaus god hath despis them.

53:6 Oh that the salvat of israel were come out of zion! when god
bringeth back the captiv of hi people, jacob shall rejoice, and
israel shall be glad.



54:1 save me, O god, by thi name, and judg me by thi strength.

54:2 hear my prayer, O god; give ear to the word of my mouth.

54:3 for stranger are risen up against me, and oppressor seek after
mi soul: they have not set god befor them. selah.

54:4 behold, god is mine helper: the lord is with them that uphold my
soul.

54:5 He shall reward evil unto mine enemies: cut them off in thy
truth.

54:6 I will freeli sacrific unto thee: I will prais thi name, o
lord; for it is good.

54:7 for he hath deliv me out of all trouble: and mine eye hath
seen hi desir upon mine enemies.



55:1 give ear to my prayer, O god; and hide not thyself from my
supplication.

55:2 attend unto me, and hear me: I mourn in my complaint, and make a
noise;

55:3 becaus of the voic of the enemy, becaus of the oppress of
th wicked: for they cast iniqu upon me, and in wrath they hate me.

55:4 My heart is sore pain within me: and the terror of death are
fallen upon me.

55:5 fear and trembl are come upon me, and horror hath
overwhelm me.

55:6 and I said, Oh that I had wing like a dove! for then would I fly
away, and be at rest.

55:7 lo, then would I wander far off, and remain in the wilderness.
selah.

55:8 I would hasten my escap from the windi storm and tempest.

55:9 destroy, O lord, and divid their tongues: for I have seen
viol and strife in the city.

55:10 day and night they go about it upon the wall thereof: mischief
also and sorrow are in the midst of it.

55:11 wicked is in the midst thereof: deceit and guil depart not
from her streets.

55:12 for it wa not an enemi that reproach me; then I could have
born it: neither wa it he that hate me that did magnifi himself
against me; then I would have hid myself from him:

55:13 but it wa thou, a man mine equal, my guide, and mine
acquaintance.

55:14 We took sweet counsel together, and walk unto the hous of god
in company.

55:15 let death seiz upon them, and let them go down quick into hell:
for wicked is in their dwellings, and among them.

55:16 As for me, I will call upon god; and the lord shall save me.

55:17 evening, and morning, and at noon, will I pray, and cri aloud:
and he shall hear my voice.

55:18 He hath deliv my soul in peac from the battl that was
against me: for there were mani with me.

55:19 god shall hear, and afflict them, even he that abideth of old.

selah. becaus they have no changes, therefor they fear not god.

55:20 He hath put forth hi hand against such as be at peac with
him: he hath broken hi covenant.

55:21 the word of hi mouth were smoother than butter, but war wa in
hi heart: hi word were softer than oil, yet were they drawn swords.

55:22 cast thi burden upon the lord, and he shall sustain thee: he
shal never suffer the righteou to be moved.

55:23 but thou, O god, shalt bring them down into the pit of
destruction: bloodi and deceit men shall not live out half their
days; but I will trust in thee.



56:1 Be merci unto me, O god: for man would swallow me up; he
fight daili oppresseth me.

56:2 mine enemi would daili swallow me up: for they be mani that
fight against me, O thou most high.

56:3 what time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

56:4 In god I will prais hi word, in god I have put my trust; I will
not fear what flesh can do unto me.

56:5 everi day they wrest my words: all their thought are against me
for evil.

56:6 they gather themselv together, they hide themselves, they mark
mi steps, when they wait for my soul.

56:7 shall they escap by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the
people, O god.

56:8 thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tear into thi bottle:
ar they not in thi book?

56:9 when I cri unto thee, then shall mine enemi turn back: thi i
know; for god is for me.

56:10 In god will I prais hi word: in the lord will I prais his
word.

56:11 In god have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do
unto me.

56:12 thi vow are upon me, O god: I will render prais unto thee.

56:13 for thou hast deliv my soul from death: wilt not thou
deliv my feet from falling, that I may walk befor god in the light
of the living?



57:1 Be merci unto me, O god, be merci unto me: for my soul
trusteth in thee: yea, in the shadow of thi wing will I make my
refuge, until these calam be overpast.

57:2 I will cri unto god most high; unto god that performeth all
th for me.

57:3 He shall send from heaven, and save me from the reproach of him
that would swallow me up. selah. god shall send forth hi merci and
hi truth.

57:4 My soul is among lions: and I lie even among them that are set on
fire, even the son of men, whose teeth are spear and arrows, and
their tongu a sharp sword.

57:5 Be thou exalted, O god, abov the heavens; let thi glori be above
al the earth.

57:6 they have prepar a net for my steps; my soul is bow down:
they have dig a pit befor me, into the midst whereof they are
fallen themselves. selah.

57:7 My heart is fixed, O god, my heart is fixed: I will sing and give
praise.

57:8 awak up, my glory; awake, psalteri and harp: I myself will awake
early.

57:9 I will prais thee, O lord, among the people: I will sing unto
the among the nations.

57:10 for thi merci is great unto the heavens, and thi truth unto the
clouds.

57:11 Be thou exalted, O god, abov the heavens: let thi glori be
abov all the earth.



58:1 Do ye inde speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge
uprightly, O ye son of men?

58:2 yea, in heart ye work wickedness; ye weigh the violenc of your
hand in the earth.

58:3 the wick are estrang from the womb: they go astray as soon as
they be born, speak lies.

58:4 their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the
deaf adder that stoppeth her ear;

58:5 which will not hearken to the voic of charmers, charm never
so wisely.

58:6 break their teeth, O god, in their mouth: break out the great
teeth of the young lions, O lord.

58:7 let them melt away as water which run continually: when he
bendeth hi bow to shoot hi arrows, let them be as cut in pieces.

58:8 As a snail which melteth, let everi one of them pass away: like
th untim birth of a woman, that they may not see the sun.

58:9 befor your pot can feel the thorns, he shall take them away as
with a whirlwind, both living, and in hi wrath.

58:10 the righteou shall rejoic when he seeth the vengeance: he
shal wash hi feet in the blood of the wicked.

58:11 So that a man shall say, verili there is a reward for the
righteous: verili he is a god that judgeth in the earth.



59:1 deliv me from mine enemies, O my god: defend me from them that
ris up against me.

59:2 deliv me from the worker of iniquity, and save me from bloody
men.

59:3 for, lo, they lie in wait for my soul: the mighti are gathered
against me; not for my transgression, nor for my sin, O lord.

59:4 they run and prepar themselv without my fault: awak to help
me, and behold.

59:5 thou therefore, O lord god of hosts, the god of israel, awak to
visit all the heathen: be not merci to ani wick transgressors.
selah.

59:6 they return at evening: they make a nois like a dog, and go
round about the city.

59:7 behold, they belch out with their mouth: sword are in their
lips: for who, say they, doth hear?

59:8 but thou, O lord, shalt laugh at them; thou shalt have all the
heathen in derision.

59:9 becaus of hi strength will I wait upon thee: for god is my
defence.

59:10 the god of my merci shall prevent me: god shall let me see my
desir upon mine enemies.

59:11 slay them not, lest my peopl forget: scatter them by thi power;
and bring them down, O lord our shield.

59:12 for the sin of their mouth and the word of their lip let them
even be taken in their pride: and for curs and lie which they
speak.

59:13 consum them in wrath, consum them, that they may not be: and
let them know that god ruleth in jacob unto the end of the earth.
selah.

59:14 and at even let them return; and let them make a nois like a
dog, and go round about the city.

59:15 let them wander up and down for meat, and grudg if they be not
satisfied.

59:16 but I will sing of thi power; yea, I will sing aloud of thy
merci in the morning: for thou hast been my defenc and refug in the
day of my trouble.

59:17 unto thee, O my strength, will I sing: for god is my defence,
and the god of my mercy.



60:1 O god, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scatter us, thou hast
been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.

60:2 thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal
th breach thereof; for it shaketh.

60:3 thou hast shew thi peopl hard things: thou hast made us to
drink the wine of astonishment.

60:4 thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be
display becaus of the truth. selah.

60:5 that thi belov may be delivered; save with thi right hand, and
hear me.

60:6 god hath spoken in hi holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide
shechem, and mete out the valley of succoth.

60:7 gilead is mine, and manasseh is mine; ephraim also is the
strength of mine head; judah is my lawgiver;

60:8 moab is my washpot; over edom will I cast out my shoe: philistia,
triumph thou becaus of me.

60:9 who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into
edom?

60:10 wilt not thou, O god, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O god,
which didst not go out with our armies?

60:11 give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

60:12 through god we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread
down our enemies.



61:1 hear my cry, O god; attend unto my prayer.

61:2 from the end of the earth will I cri unto thee, when my heart is
overwhelmed: lead me to the rock that is higher than i.

61:3 for thou hast been a shelter for me, and a strong tower from the
enemy.

61:4 I will abid in thi tabernacl for ever: I will trust in the
covert of thi wings. selah.

61:5 for thou, O god, hast heard my vows: thou hast given me the
heritag of those that fear thi name.

61:6 thou wilt prolong the king' life: and hi year as many
generations.

61:7 He shall abid befor god for ever: O prepar merci and truth,
which may preserv him.

61:8 So will I sing prais unto thi name for ever, that I may daily
perform my vows.



62:1 truli my soul waiteth upon god: from him cometh my salvation.

62:2 He onli is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall
not be greatli moved.

62:3 how long will ye imagin mischief against a man? ye shall be
slain all of you: as a bow wall shall ye be, and as a tottering
fence.

62:4 they onli consult to cast him down from hi excellency: they
delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curs inwardly.
selah.

62:5 My soul, wait thou onli upon god; for my expect is from him.

62:6 He onli is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall
not be moved.

62:7 In god is my salvat and my glory: the rock of my strength, and
mi refuge, is in god.

62:8 trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before
him: god is a refug for us. selah.

62:9 sure men of low degre are vanity, and men of high degre are a
lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogeth lighter than
vanity.

62:10 trust not in oppression, and becom not vain in robbery: if
rich increase, set not your heart upon them.

62:11 god hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power
belongeth unto god.

62:12 also unto thee, O lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to
everi man accord to hi work.



63:1 O god, thou art my god; earli will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth
for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dri and thirsti land, where
no water is;

63:2 To see thi power and thi glory, so as I have seen thee in the
sanctuary.

63:3 becaus thi lovingkind is better than life, my lip shall
prais thee.

63:4 thu will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hand in
thi name.

63:5 My soul shall be satisfi as with marrow and fatness; and my
mouth shall prais thee with joy lips:

63:6 when I rememb thee upon my bed, and medit on thee in the
night watches.

63:7 becaus thou hast been my help, therefor in the shadow of thy
w will I rejoice.

63:8 My soul followeth hard after thee: thi right hand upholdeth me.

63:9 but those that seek my soul, to destroy it, shall go into the
low part of the earth.

63:10 they shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.

63:11 but the king shall rejoic in god; everi one that sweareth by
him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lie shall be
stopped.



64:1 hear my voice, O god, in my prayer: preserv my life from fear of
th enemy.

64:2 hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the
insurrect of the worker of iniquity:

64:3 who whet their tongu like a sword, and bend their bow to shoot
their arrows, even bitter words:

64:4 that they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenli do they
shoot at him, and fear not.

64:5 they encourag themselv in an evil matter: they commun of
lay snare privily; they say, who shall see them?

64:6 they search out iniquities; they accomplish a dilig search:
both the inward thought of everi one of them, and the heart, is deep.

64:7 but god shall shoot at them with an arrow; suddenli shall they be
wounded.

64:8 So they shall make their own tongu to fall upon themselves: all
that see them shall flee away.

64:9 and all men shall fear, and shall declar the work of god; for
they shall wise consid of hi doing.

64:10 the righteou shall be glad in the lord, and shall trust in him;
and all the upright in heart shall glory.



65:1 prais waiteth for thee, O god, in sion: and unto thee shall the
vow be performed.

65:2 O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall all flesh come.

65:3 iniqu prevail against me: as for our transgressions, thou
shalt purg them away.

65:4 bless is the man whom thou choosest, and causest to approach
unto thee, that he may dwell in thi courts: we shall be satisfi with
th good of thi house, even of thi holi temple.

65:5 By terribl thing in righteous wilt thou answer us, O god of
our salvation; who art the confid of all the end of the earth,
and of them that are afar off upon the sea:

65:6 which by hi strength setteth fast the mountains; be girded
with power:

65:7 which stilleth the nois of the seas, the nois of their waves,
and the tumult of the people.

65:8 they also that dwell in the uttermost part are afraid at thy
tokens: thou makest the outgo of the morn and even to
rejoice.

65:9 thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatli enrichest
it with the river of god, which is full of water: thou preparest them
corn, when thou hast so provid for it.

65:10 thou waterest the ridg thereof abundantly: thou settlest the
furrow thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the
spring thereof.

65:11 thou crownest the year with thi goodness; and thi path drop
fatness.

65:12 they drop upon the pastur of the wilderness: and the little
hil rejoic on everi side.

65:13 the pastur are cloth with flocks; the valley also are
cov over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.



66:1 make a joy nois unto god, all ye lands:

66:2 sing forth the honour of hi name: make hi prais glorious.

66:3 say unto god, how terribl art thou in thi works! through the
great of thi power shall thine enemi submit themselv unto
thee.

66:4 all the earth shall worship thee, and shall sing unto thee; they
shal sing to thi name. selah.

66:5 come and see the work of god: he is terribl in hi do toward
th children of men.

66:6 He turn the sea into dri land: they went through the flood on
foot: there did we rejoic in him.

66:7 He ruleth by hi power for ever; hi eye behold the nations: let
not the rebelli exalt themselves. selah.

66:8 O bless our god, ye people, and make the voic of hi prais to
b heard:

66:9 which holdeth our soul in life, and suffereth not our feet to be
moved.

66:10 for thou, O god, hast prove us: thou hast tri us, as silver
i tried.

66:11 thou broughtest us into the net; thou laidst afflict upon our
loins.

66:12 thou hast caus men to ride over our heads; we went through
fir and through water: but thou broughtest us out into a wealthy
place.

66:13 I will go into thi hous with burnt offerings: I will pay thee
mi vows,

66:14 which my lip have uttered, and my mouth hath spoken, when I was
in trouble.

66:15 I will offer unto thee burnt sacrific of fatlings, with the
incens of rams; I will offer bullock with goats. selah.

66:16 come and hear, all ye that fear god, and I will declar what he
hath done for my soul.

66:17 I cri unto him with my mouth, and he wa extol with my
tongue.

66:18 If I regard iniqu in my heart, the lord will not hear me:

66:19 but verili god hath heard me; he hath attend to the voic of
mi prayer.

66:20 bless be god, which hath not turn away my prayer, nor his
merci from me.



67:1 god be merci unto us, and bless us; and caus hi face to
shin upon us; selah.

67:2 that thi way may be known upon earth, thi save health among all
nations.

67:3 let the peopl prais thee, O god; let all the peopl praise
thee.

67:4 O let the nation be glad and sing for joy: for thou shalt judge
th peopl righteously, and govern the nation upon earth. selah.

67:5 let the peopl prais thee, O god; let all the peopl praise
thee.

67:6 then shall the earth yield her increase; and god, even our own
god, shall bless us.

67:7 god shall bless us; and all the end of the earth shall fear him.



68:1 let god arise, let hi enemi be scattered: let them also that
hat him flee befor him.

68:2 As smoke is driven away, so drive them away: as wax melteth
befor the fire, so let the wick perish at the presenc of god.

68:3 but let the righteou be glad; let them rejoic befor god: yea,
let them exceedingli rejoice.

68:4 sing unto god, sing prais to hi name: extol him that rideth
upon the heaven by hi name jah, and rejoic befor him.

68:5 A father of the fatherless, and a judg of the widows, is god in
hi holi habitation.

68:6 god setteth the solitari in families: he bringeth out those which
ar bound with chains: but the rebelli dwell in a dri land.

68:7 O god, when thou wentest forth befor thi people, when thou didst
march through the wilderness; selah:

68:8 the earth shook, the heaven also drop at the presenc of god:
even sinai itself wa move at the presenc of god, the god of israel.

68:9 thou, O god, didst send a plenti rain, wherebi thou didst
confirm thine inheritance, when it wa weary.

68:10 thi congreg hath dwelt therein: thou, O god, hast prepared
of thi good for the poor.

68:11 the lord gave the word: great wa the compani of those that
publish it.

68:12 king of armi did flee apace: and she that tarri at home
divid the spoil.

68:13 though ye have lien among the pots, yet shall ye be as the wings
of a dove cover with silver, and her feather with yellow gold.

68:14 when the almighti scatter king in it, it wa white as snow in
salmon.

68:15 the hill of god is as the hill of bashan; an high hill as the
hil of bashan.

68:16 whi leap ye, ye high hills? thi is the hill which god desireth
to dwell in; yea, the lord will dwell in it for ever.

68:17 the chariot of god are twenti thousand, even thousand of
angels: the lord is among them, as in sinai, in the holi place.

68:18 thou hast ascend on high, thou hast led captiv captive:
th hast receiv gift for men; yea, for the rebelli also, that
th lord god might dwell among them.

68:19 bless be the lord, who daili loadeth us with benefits, even
th god of our salvation. selah.

68:20 He that is our god is the god of salvation; and unto god the
lord belong the issu from death.

68:21 but god shall wound the head of hi enemies, and the hairi scalp
of such an one as goeth on still in hi trespasses.

68:22 the lord said, I will bring again from bashan, I will bring my
peopl again from the depth of the sea:

68:23 that thi foot may be dip in the blood of thine enemies, and
th tongu of thi dog in the same.

68:24 they have seen thi goings, O god; even the go of my god, my
king, in the sanctuary.

68:25 the singer went before, the player on instrument followed
after; among them were the damsel play with timbrels.

68:26 bless ye god in the congregations, even the lord, from the
fountain of israel.

68:27 there is littl benjamin with their ruler, the princ of judah
and their council, the princ of zebulun, and the princ of
naphtali.

68:28 thi god hath command thi strength: strengthen, O god, that
which thou hast wrought for us.

68:29 becaus of thi templ at jerusalem shall king bring presents
unto thee.

68:30 rebuk the compani of spearmen, the multitud of the bulls, with
th calv of the people, till everi one submit himself with piec of
silver: scatter thou the peopl that delight in war.

68:31 princ shall come out of egypt; ethiopia shall soon stretch out
her hand unto god.

68:32 sing unto god, ye kingdom of the earth; O sing prais unto the
lord; selah:

68:33 To him that rideth upon the heaven of heavens, which were of
old; lo, he doth send out hi voice, and that a mighti voice.

68:34 ascrib ye strength unto god: hi excel is over israel, and
hi strength is in the clouds.

68:35 O god, thou art terribl out of thi holi places: the god of
israel is he that giveth strength and power unto hi people. blessed
b god.



69:1 save me, O god; for the water are come in unto my soul.

69:2 I sink in deep mire, where there is no standing: I am come into
deep waters, where the flood overflow me.

69:3 I am weari of my crying: my throat is dried: mine eye fail while
i wait for my god.

69:4 they that hate me without a caus are more than the hair of mine
head: they that would destroy me, be mine enemi wrongfully, are
mighty: then I restor that which I took not away.

69:5 O god, thou knowest my foolishness; and my sin are not hid from
thee.

69:6 let not them that wait on thee, O lord god of hosts, be ashamed
for my sake: let not those that seek thee be confound for my sake, o
god of israel.

69:7 becaus for thi sake I have born reproach; shame hath cover my
face.

69:8 I am becom a stranger unto my brethren, and an alien unto my
mother' children.

69:9 for the zeal of thine hous hath eaten me up; and the reproaches
of them that reproach thee are fallen upon me.

69:10 when I wept, and chasten my soul with fasting, that wa to my
reproach.

69:11 I made sackcloth also my garment; and I becam a proverb to
them.

69:12 they that sit in the gate speak against me; and I wa the song
of the drunkards.

69:13 but as for me, my prayer is unto thee, O lord, in an acceptable
time: O god, in the multitud of thi merci hear me, in the truth of
thi salvation.

69:14 deliv me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be
deliv from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters.

69:15 let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow
m up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me.

69:16 hear me, O lord; for thi lovingkind is good: turn unto me
accord to the multitud of thi tender mercies.

69:17 and hide not thi face from thi servant; for I am in trouble:
hear me speedily.

69:18 draw nigh unto my soul, and redeem it: deliv me becaus of
min enemies.

69:19 thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour:
min adversari are all befor thee.

69:20 reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and i
look for some to take pity, but there wa none; and for comforters,
but I found none.

69:21 they gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave
m vinegar to drink.

69:22 let their tabl becom a snare befor them: and that which
should have been for their welfare, let it becom a trap.

69:23 let their eye be darkened, that they see not; and make their
loin continu to shake.

69:24 pour out thine indign upon them, and let thi wrath anger
tak hold of them.

69:25 let their habit be desolate; and let none dwell in their
tents.

69:26 for they persecut him whom thou hast smitten; and they talk to
th grief of those whom thou hast wounded.

69:27 add iniqu unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy
righteousness.

69:28 let them be blot out of the book of the living, and not be
written with the righteous.

69:29 but I am poor and sorrowful: let thi salvation, O god, set me up
on high.

69:30 I will prais the name of god with a song, and will magnifi him
with thanksgiving.

69:31 thi also shall pleas the lord better than an ox or bullock
that hath horn and hoofs.

69:32 the humbl shall see this, and be glad: and your heart shall
liv that seek god.

69:33 for the lord heareth the poor, and despiseth not hi prisoners.

69:34 let the heaven and earth prais him, the seas, and everi thing
that moveth therein.

69:35 for god will save zion, and will build the citi of judah: that
they may dwell there, and have it in possession.

69:36 the seed also of hi servant shall inherit it: and they that
lov hi name shall dwell therein.



70:1 make haste, O god, to deliv me; make hast to help me, O lord.

70:2 let them be asham and confound that seek after my soul: let
them be turn backward, and put to confusion, that desir my hurt.

70:3 let them be turn back for a reward of their shame that say,
aha, aha.

70:4 let all those that seek thee rejoic and be glad in thee: and let
such as love thi salvat say continually, let god be magnified.

70:5 but I am poor and needy: make hast unto me, O god: thou art my
help and my deliverer; O lord, make no tarrying.



71:1 In thee, O lord, do I put my trust: let me never be put to
confusion.

71:2 deliv me in thi righteousness, and caus me to escape: incline
thin ear unto me, and save me.

71:3 Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continu resort:
th hast given command to save me; for thou art my rock and my
fortress.

71:4 deliv me, O my god, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the
hand of the unright and cruel man.

71:5 for thou art my hope, O lord god: thou art my trust from my
youth.

71:6 By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that
took me out of my mother' bowels: my prais shall be continu of
thee.

71:7 I am as a wonder unto many; but thou art my strong refuge.

71:8 let my mouth be fill with thi prais and with thi honour all
th day.

71:9 cast me not off in the time of old age; forsak me not when my
strength faileth.

71:10 for mine enemi speak against me; and they that lay wait for my
soul take counsel together,

71:11 saying, god hath forsaken him: persecut and take him; for there
i none to deliv him.

71:12 O god, be not far from me: O my god, make hast for my help.

71:13 let them be confound and consum that are adversari to my
soul; let them be cover with reproach and dishonour that seek my
hurt.

71:14 but I will hope continually, and will yet prais thee more and
more.

71:15 My mouth shall shew forth thi righteous and thi salvation
al the day; for I know not the number thereof.

71:16 I will go in the strength of the lord god: I will make mention
of thi righteousness, even of thine only.

71:17 O god, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have i
declar thi wondrou works.

71:18 now also when I am old and greyheaded, O god, forsak me not;
until I have shew thi strength unto thi generation, and thi power
to everi one that is to come.

71:19 thi righteous also, O god, is veri high, who hast done great
things: O god, who is like unto thee!

71:20 thou, which hast shew me great and sore troubles, shalt
quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depth of the
earth.

71:21 thou shalt increas my greatness, and comfort me on everi side.

71:22 I will also prais thee with the psaltery, even thi truth, O my
god: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou holi one of israel.

71:23 My lip shall greatli rejoic when I sing unto thee; and my
soul, which thou hast redeemed.

71:24 My tongu also shall talk of thi righteous all the day long:
for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that seek my
hurt.



72:1 give the king thi judgments, O god, and thi righteous unto
th king' son.

72:2 He shall judg thi peopl with righteousness, and thi poor with
judgment.

72:3 the mountain shall bring peac to the people, and the little
hills, by righteousness.

72:4 He shall judg the poor of the people, he shall save the children
of the needy, and shall break in piec the oppressor.

72:5 they shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure,
throughout all generations.

72:6 He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as shower that
wat the earth.

72:7 In hi day shall the righteou flourish; and abund of peace
so long as the moon endureth.

72:8 He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river
unto the end of the earth.

72:9 they that dwell in the wilder shall bow befor him; and his
enemi shall lick the dust.

72:10 the king of tarshish and of the isl shall bring presents: the
k of sheba and seba shall offer gifts.

72:11 yea, all king shall fall down befor him: all nation shall
serv him.

72:12 for he shall deliv the needi when he crieth; the poor also,
and him that hath no helper.

72:13 He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the soul of
th needy.

72:14 He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and
preci shall their blood be in hi sight.

72:15 and he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of
sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; and daili shall
h be praised.

72:16 there shall be an hand of corn in the earth upon the top of
th mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like lebanon: and they of
th citi shall flourish like grass of the earth.

72:17 hi name shall endur for ever: hi name shall be continu as
long as the sun: and men shall be bless in him: all nation shall
cal him blessed.

72:18 bless be the lord god, the god of israel, who onli doeth
wondr things.

72:19 and bless be hi gloriou name for ever: and let the whole
earth be fill with hi glory; amen, and amen.

72:20 the prayer of david the son of jess are ended.



73:1 truli god is good to israel, even to such as are of a clean
heart.

73:2 but as for me, my feet were almost gone; my step had well nigh
slipped.

73:3 for I wa enviou at the foolish, when I saw the prosper of
th wicked.

73:4 for there are no band in their death: but their strength is
firm.

73:5 they are not in troubl as other men; neither are they plagued
lik other men.

73:6 therefor pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence
covereth them as a garment.

73:7 their eye stand out with fatness: they have more than heart
could wish.

73:8 they are corrupt, and speak wickedli concern oppression: they
speak loftily.

73:9 they set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue
walketh through the earth.

73:10 therefor hi peopl return hither: and water of a full cup are
wrung out to them.

73:11 and they say, how doth god know? and is there knowledg in the
most high?

73:12 behold, these are the ungodly, who prosper in the world; they
increas in riches.

73:13 verili I have cleans my heart in vain, and wash my hand in
innocency.

73:14 for all the day long have I been plagued, and chasten every
morning.

73:15 If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend against the
gener of thi children.

73:16 when I thought to know this, it wa too pain for me;

73:17 until I went into the sanctuari of god; then understood I their
end.

73:18 sure thou didst set them in slipperi places: thou castedst
them down into destruction.

73:19 how are they brought into desolation, as in a moment! they are
utterli consum with terrors.

73:20 As a dream when one awaketh; so, O lord, when thou awakest, thou
shalt despis their image.

73:21 thu my heart wa grieved, and I wa prick in my reins.

73:22 So foolish wa I, and ignorant: I wa as a beast befor thee.

73:23 nevertheless I am continu with thee: thou hast holden me by
mi right hand.

73:24 thou shalt guid me with thi counsel, and afterward receiv me
to glory.

73:25 whom have I in heaven but thee? and there is none upon earth
that I desir besid thee.

73:26 My flesh and my heart faileth: but god is the strength of my
heart, and my portion for ever.

73:27 for, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast
destroy all them that go a whore from thee.

73:28 but it is good for me to draw near to god: I have put my trust
in the lord god, that I may declar all thi works.



74:1 O god, whi hast thou cast us off for ever? whi doth thine anger
smok against the sheep of thi pasture?

74:2 rememb thi congregation, which thou hast purchas of old; the
rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; thi mount zion,
wherein thou hast dwelt.

74:3 lift up thi feet unto the perpetu desolations; even all that
th enemi hath done wickedli in the sanctuary.

74:4 thine enemi roar in the midst of thi congregations; they set up
their ensign for signs.

74:5 A man wa famou accord as he had lift up axe upon the
thick trees.

74:6 but now they break down the carv work thereof at onc with axes
and hammers.

74:7 they have cast fire into thi sanctuary, they have defil by
cast down the dwell place of thi name to the ground.

74:8 they said in their hearts, let us destroy them together: they
hav burn up all the synagogu of god in the land.

74:9 We see not our signs: there is no more ani prophet: neither is
ther among us ani that knoweth how long.

74:10 O god, how long shall the adversari reproach? shall the enemy
blasphem thi name for ever?

74:11 whi withdrawest thou thi hand, even thi right hand? pluck it out
of thi bosom.

74:12 for god is my king of old, work salvat in the midst of the
earth.

74:13 thou didst divid the sea by thi strength: thou brakest the
head of the dragon in the waters.

74:14 thou brakest the head of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to
b meat to the peopl inhabit the wilderness.

74:15 thou didst cleav the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up
mighti rivers.

74:16 the day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared
th light and the sun.

74:17 thou hast set all the border of the earth: thou hast made
summ and winter.

74:18 rememb this, that the enemi hath reproached, O lord, and that
th foolish peopl have blasphem thi name.

74:19 O deliv not the soul of thi turtledov unto the multitud of
th wicked: forget not the congreg of thi poor for ever.

74:20 have respect unto the covenant: for the dark place of the earth
ar full of the habit of cruelty.

74:21 O let not the oppress return ashamed: let the poor and needy
prais thi name.

74:22 arise, O god, plead thine own cause: rememb how the foolish
man reproacheth thee daily.

74:23 forget not the voic of thine enemies: the tumult of those that
ris up against thee increaseth continually.



75:1 unto thee, O god, do we give thanks, unto thee do we give thanks:
for that thi name is near thi wondrou work declare.

75:2 when I shall receiv the congreg I will judg uprightly.

75:3 the earth and all the inhabit thereof are dissolved: I bear
up the pillar of it. selah.

75:4 I said unto the fools, deal not foolishly: and to the wicked,
lift not up the horn:

75:5 lift not up your horn on high: speak not with a stiff neck.

75:6 for promot cometh neither from the east, nor from the west,
nor from the south.

75:7 but god is the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth up
another.

75:8 for in the hand of the lord there is a cup, and the wine is red;
it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the same: but the dregs
thereof, all the wick of the earth shall wring them out, and drink
them.

75:9 but I will declar for ever; I will sing prais to the god of
jacob.

75:10 all the horn of the wick also will I cut off; but the horns
of the righteou shall be exalted.



76:1 In judah is god known: hi name is great in israel.

76:2 In salem also is hi tabernacle, and hi dwell place in zion.

76:3 there brake he the arrow of the bow, the shield, and the sword,
and the battle. selah.

76:4 thou art more gloriou and excel than the mountain of prey.

76:5 the stoutheart are spoiled, they have slept their sleep: and
non of the men of might have found their hands.

76:6 At thi rebuke, O god of jacob, both the chariot and hors are
cast into a dead sleep.

76:7 thou, even thou, art to be feared: and who may stand in thi sight
when onc thou art angry?

76:8 thou didst caus judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth
feared, and wa still,

76:9 when god aros to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth.
selah.

76:10 sure the wrath of man shall prais thee: the remaind of
wrath shalt thou restrain.

76:11 vow, and pay unto the lord your god: let all that be round about
him bring present unto him that ought to be feared.

76:12 He shall cut off the spirit of princes: he is terribl to the
k of the earth.



77:1 I cri unto god with my voice, even unto god with my voice; and
h gave ear unto me.

77:2 In the day of my troubl I sought the lord: my sore ran in the
night, and ceas not: my soul refus to be comforted.

77:3 I rememb god, and wa troubled: I complained, and my spirit
wa overwhelmed. selah.

77:4 thou holdest mine eye waking: I am so troubl that I cannot
speak.

77:5 I have consid the day of old, the year of ancient times.

77:6 I call to remembr my song in the night: I commun with mine
own heart: and my spirit made dilig search.

77:7 will the lord cast off for ever? and will he be favour no
more?

77:8 Is hi merci clean gone for ever? doth hi promis fail for
evermore?

77:9 hath god forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up his
tend mercies? selah.

77:10 and I said, thi is my infirmity: but I will rememb the years
of the right hand of the most high.

77:11 I will rememb the work of the lord: sure I will remember
thi wonder of old.

77:12 I will medit also of all thi work, and talk of thi doings.

77:13 thi way, O god, is in the sanctuary: who is so great a god as
our god?

77:14 thou art the god that doest wonders: thou hast declar thy
strength among the people.

77:15 thou hast with thine arm redeem thi people, the son of jacob
and joseph. selah.

77:16 the water saw thee, O god, the water saw thee; they were
afraid: the depth also were troubled.

77:17 the cloud pour out water: the sky sent out a sound: thine
arrow also went abroad.

77:18 the voic of thi thunder wa in the heaven: the lightnings
lighten the world: the earth trembl and shook.

77:19 thi way is in the sea, and thi path in the great waters, and thy
footstep are not known.

77:20 thou leddest thi peopl like a flock by the hand of mose and
aaron.



78:1 give ear, O my people, to my law: inclin your ear to the words
of my mouth.

78:2 I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark say of
old:

78:3 which we have heard and known, and our father have told us.

78:4 We will not hide them from their children, shew to the
gener to come the prais of the lord, and hi strength, and his
wond work that he hath done.

78:5 for he establish a testimoni in jacob, and appoint a law in
israel, which he command our fathers, that they should make them
known to their children:

78:6 that the gener to come might know them, even the children
which should be born; who should aris and declar them to their
children:

78:7 that they might set their hope in god, and not forget the works
of god, but keep hi commandments:

78:8 and might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious
generation; a gener that set not their heart aright, and whose
spirit wa not stedfast with god.

78:9 the children of ephraim, be armed, and carri bows, turned
back in the day of battle.

78:10 they kept not the coven of god, and refus to walk in his
law;

78:11 and forgat hi works, and hi wonder that he had shew them.

78:12 marvel thing did he in the sight of their fathers, in the
land of egypt, in the field of zoan.

78:13 He divid the sea, and caus them to pass through; and he made
th water to stand as an heap.

78:14 In the daytim also he led them with a cloud, and all the night
with a light of fire.

78:15 He clave the rock in the wilderness, and gave them drink as out
of the great depths.

78:16 He brought stream also out of the rock, and caus water to
run down like rivers.

78:17 and they sin yet more against him by provok the most high
in the wilderness.

78:18 and they tempt god in their heart by ask meat for their
lust.

78:19 yea, they spake against god; they said, can god furnish a table
in the wilderness?

78:20 behold, he smote the rock, that the water gush out, and the
stream overflowed; can he give bread also? can he provid flesh for
hi people?

78:21 therefor the lord heard this, and wa wroth: so a fire was
kindl against jacob, and anger also came up against israel;

78:22 becaus they believ not in god, and trust not in his
salvation:

78:23 though he had command the cloud from above, and open the
door of heaven,

78:24 and had rain down manna upon them to eat, and had given them
of the corn of heaven.

78:25 man did eat angels' food: he sent them meat to the full.

78:26 He caus an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by hi power
h brought in the south wind.

78:27 He rain flesh also upon them as dust, and feather fowl like
a the sand of the sea:

78:28 and he let it fall in the midst of their camp, round about their
habitations.

78:29 So they did eat, and were well filled: for he gave them their
own desire;

78:30 they were not estrang from their lust. but while their meat
wa yet in their mouths,

78:31 the wrath of god came upon them, and slew the fattest of them,
and smote down the chosen men of israel.

78:32 for all thi they sin still, and believ not for his
wondr works.

78:33 therefor their day did he consum in vanity, and their years
in trouble.

78:34 when he slew them, then they sought him: and they return and
enquir earli after god.

78:35 and they rememb that god wa their rock, and the high god
their redeemer.

78:36 nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they
li unto him with their tongues.

78:37 for their heart wa not right with him, neither were they
stedfast in hi covenant.

78:38 but he, be full of compassion, forgav their iniquity, and
destroy them not: yea, mani a time turn he hi anger away, and did
not stir up all hi wrath.

78:39 for he rememb that they were but flesh; a wind that passeth
away, and cometh not again.

78:40 how oft did they provok him in the wilderness, and griev him
in the desert!

78:41 yea, they turn back and tempt god, and limit the holi one
of israel.

78:42 they rememb not hi hand, nor the day when he deliv them
from the enemy.

78:43 how he had wrought hi sign in egypt, and hi wonder in the
field of zoan.

78:44 and had turn their river into blood; and their floods, that
they could not drink.

78:45 He sent diver sort of fli among them, which devour them;
and frogs, which destroy them.

78:46 He gave also their increas unto the caterpiller, and their
labour unto the locust.

78:47 He destroy their vine with hail, and their sycomor trees
with frost.

78:48 He gave up their cattl also to the hail, and their flock to
hot thunderbolts.

78:49 He cast upon them the fierc of hi anger, wrath, and
indignation, and trouble, by send evil angel among them.

78:50 He made a way to hi anger; he spare not their soul from death,
but gave their life over to the pestilence;

78:51 and smote all the firstborn in egypt; the chief of their
strength in the tabernacl of ham:

78:52 but made hi own peopl to go forth like sheep, and guid them
in the wilder like a flock.

78:53 and he led them on safely, so that they fear not: but the sea
overwhelm their enemies.

78:54 and he brought them to the border of hi sanctuary, even to this
mountain, which hi right hand had purchased.

78:55 He cast out the heathen also befor them, and divid them an
inherit by line, and made the tribe of israel to dwell in their
tents.

78:56 yet they tempt and provok the most high god, and kept not
hi testimonies:

78:57 but turn back, and dealt unfaith like their fathers: they
wer turn asid like a deceit bow.

78:58 for they provok him to anger with their high places, and moved
him to jealousi with their graven images.

78:59 when god heard this, he wa wroth, and greatli abhor israel:

78:60 So that he forsook the tabernacl of shiloh, the tent which he
plac among men;

78:61 and deliv hi strength into captivity, and hi glori into
th enemy' hand.

78:62 He gave hi peopl over also unto the sword; and wa wroth with
hi inheritance.

78:63 the fire consum their young men; and their maiden were not
given to marriage.

78:64 their priest fell by the sword; and their widow made no
lamentation.

78:65 then the lord awak as one out of sleep, and like a mighti man
that shouteth by reason of wine.

78:66 and he smote hi enemi in the hinder parts: he put them to a
perpetu reproach.

78:67 moreov he refus the tabernacl of joseph, and chose not the
trib of ephraim:

78:68 but chose the tribe of judah, the mount zion which he loved.

78:69 and he built hi sanctuari like high palaces, like the earth
which he hath establish for ever.

78:70 He chose david also hi servant, and took him from the
sheepfolds:

78:71 from follow the ewe great with young he brought him to feed
jacob hi people, and israel hi inheritance.

78:72 So he fed them accord to the integr of hi heart; and
guid them by the skil of hi hands.



79:1 O god, the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thi holy
templ have they defiled; they have laid jerusalem on heaps.

79:2 the dead bodi of thi servant have they given to be meat unto
th fowl of the heaven, the flesh of thi saint unto the beast of
th earth.

79:3 their blood have they shed like water round about jerusalem; and
ther wa none to buri them.

79:4 We are becom a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision
to them that are round about us.

79:5 how long, lord? wilt thou be angri for ever? shall thi jealousy
burn like fire?

79:6 pour out thi wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and
upon the kingdom that have not call upon thi name.

79:7 for they have devour jacob, and laid wast hi dwell place.

79:8 O rememb not against us former iniquities: let thi tender
merci speedili prevent us: for we are brought veri low.

79:9 help us, O god of our salvation, for the glori of thi name: and
deliv us, and purg away our sins, for thi name' sake.

79:10 wherefor should the heathen say, where is their god? let him be
known among the heathen in our sight by the reveng of the blood of
thi servant which is shed.

79:11 let the sigh of the prison come befor thee; accord to
th great of thi power preserv thou those that are appoint to
die;

79:12 and render unto our neighbour sevenfold into their bosom their
reproach, wherewith they have reproach thee, O lord.

79:13 So we thi peopl and sheep of thi pastur will give thee thanks
for ever: we will shew forth thi prais to all generations.



80:1 give ear, O shepherd of israel, thou that leadest joseph like a
flock; thou that dwellest between the cherubims, shine forth.

80:2 befor ephraim and benjamin and manasseh stir up thi strength,
and come and save us.

80:3 turn us again, O god, and caus thi face to shine; and we shall
b saved.

80:4 O lord god of hosts, how long wilt thou be angri against the
pray of thi people?

80:5 thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them tears
to drink in great measure.

80:6 thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies
laugh among themselves.

80:7 turn us again, O god of hosts, and caus thi face to shine; and
w shall be saved.

80:8 thou hast brought a vine out of egypt: thou hast cast out the
heathen, and plant it.

80:9 thou preparedst room befor it, and didst caus it to take deep
root, and it fill the land.

80:10 the hill were cover with the shadow of it, and the boughs
thereof were like the goodli cedars.

80:11 she sent out her bough unto the sea, and her branch unto the
river.

80:12 whi hast thou then broken down her hedges, so that all they
which pass by the way do pluck her?

80:13 the boar out of the wood doth wast it, and the wild beast of
th field doth devour it.

80:14 return, we beseech thee, O god of hosts: look down from heaven,
and behold, and visit thi vine;

80:15 and the vineyard which thi right hand hath planted, and the
branch that thou madest strong for thyself.

80:16 It is burn with fire, it is cut down: they perish at the
rebuk of thi countenance.

80:17 let thi hand be upon the man of thi right hand, upon the son of
man whom thou madest strong for thyself.

80:18 So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will call
upon thi name.

80:19 turn us again, O lord god of hosts, caus thi face to shine; and
w shall be saved.



81:1 sing aloud unto god our strength: make a joy nois unto the
god of jacob.

81:2 take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp
with the psaltery.

81:3 blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on
our solemn feast day.

81:4 for thi wa a statut for israel, and a law of the god of jacob.

81:5 thi he ordain in joseph for a testimony, when he went out
through the land of egypt: where I heard a languag that I understood
not.

81:6 I remov hi shoulder from the burden: hi hand were delivered
from the pots.

81:7 thou calledst in trouble, and I deliv thee; I answer thee
in the secret place of thunder: I prove thee at the water of
meribah.

selah.

81:8 hear, O my people, and I will testifi unto thee: O israel, if
thou wilt hearken unto me;

81:9 there shall no strang god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship
ani strang god.

81:10 I am the lord thi god, which brought thee out of the land of
egypt: open thi mouth wide, and I will fill it.

81:11 but my peopl would not hearken to my voice; and israel would
non of me.

81:12 So I gave them up unto their own hearts' lust: and they walked
in their own counsels.

81:13 Oh that my peopl had hearken unto me, and israel had walked
in my ways!

81:14 I should soon have subdu their enemies, and turn my hand
against their adversaries.

81:15 the hater of the lord should have submit themselv unto
him: but their time should have endur for ever.

81:16 He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and
with honey out of the rock should I have satisfi thee.



82:1 god standeth in the congreg of the mighty; he judgeth among
th gods.

82:2 how long will ye judg unjustly, and accept the person of the
wicked? selah.

82:3 defend the poor and fatherless: do justic to the afflict and
needy.

82:4 deliv the poor and needy: rid them out of the hand of the
wicked.

82:5 they know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in
darkness: all the foundat of the earth are out of course.

82:6 I have said, Ye are gods; and all of you are children of the most
high.

82:7 but ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.

82:8 arise, O god, judg the earth: for thou shalt inherit all
nations.



83:1 keep not thou silence, O god: hold not thi peace, and be not
still, O god.

83:2 for, lo, thine enemi make a tumult: and they that hate thee
hav lift up the head.

83:3 they have taken crafti counsel against thi people, and consulted
against thi hidden ones.

83:4 they have said, come, and let us cut them off from be a
nation; that the name of israel may be no more in remembrance.

83:5 for they have consult togeth with one consent: they are
confeder against thee:

83:6 the tabernacl of edom, and the ishmaelites; of moab, and the
hagarenes;

83:7 gebal, and ammon, and amalek; the philistin with the
inhabit of tyre;

83:8 assur also is join with them: they have holpen the children of
lot.

selah.

83:9 Do unto them as unto the midianites; as to sisera, as to jabin,
at the brook of kison:

83:10 which perish at endor: they becam as dung for the earth.

83:11 make their nobl like oreb, and like zeeb: yea, all their
princ as zebah, and as zalmunna:

83:12 who said, let us take to ourselv the hous of god in
possession.

83:13 O my god, make them like a wheel; as the stubbl befor the
wind.

83:14 As the fire burneth a wood, and as the flame setteth the
mountain on fire;

83:15 So persecut them with thi tempest, and make them afraid with
thi storm.

83:16 fill their face with shame; that they may seek thi name, o
lord.

83:17 let them be confound and troubl for ever; yea, let them be
put to shame, and perish:

83:18 that men may know that thou, whose name alon is jehovah, art
th most high over all the earth.



84:1 how amiabl are thi tabernacles, O lord of hosts!

84:2 My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the court of the lord:
mi heart and my flesh crieth out for the live god.

84:3 yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest for
herself, where she may lay her young, even thine altars, O lord of
hosts, my king, and my god.

84:4 bless are they that dwell in thi house: they will be still
prais thee. selah.

84:5 bless is the man whose strength is in thee; in whose heart are
th way of them.

84:6 who pass through the valley of baca make it a well; the rain
also filleth the pools.

84:7 they go from strength to strength, everi one of them in zion
appeareth befor god.

84:8 O lord god of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O god of jacob.
selah.

84:9 behold, O god our shield, and look upon the face of thine
anointed.

84:10 for a day in thi court is better than a thousand. I had rather
b a doorkeep in the hous of my god, than to dwell in the tent of
wickedness.

84:11 for the lord god is a sun and shield: the lord will give grace
and glory: no good thing will he withhold from them that walk
uprightly.

84:12 O lord of hosts, bless is the man that trusteth in thee.



85:1 lord, thou hast been favour unto thi land: thou hast brought
back the captiv of jacob.

85:2 thou hast forgiven the iniqu of thi people, thou hast covered
al their sin. selah.

85:3 thou hast taken away all thi wrath: thou hast turn thyself from
th fierc of thine anger.

85:4 turn us, O god of our salvation, and caus thine anger toward us
to cease.

85:5 wilt thou be angri with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine
ang to all generations?

85:6 wilt thou not reviv us again: that thi peopl may rejoic in
thee?

85:7 shew us thi mercy, O lord, and grant us thi salvation.

85:8 I will hear what god the lord will speak: for he will speak peace
unto hi people, and to hi saints: but let them not turn again to
folly.

85:9 sure hi salvat is nigh them that fear him; that glori may
dwel in our land.

85:10 merci and truth are met together; righteous and peac have
kiss each other.

85:11 truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteous shall
look down from heaven.

85:12 yea, the lord shall give that which is good; and our land shall
yield her increase.

85:13 righteous shall go befor him; and shall set us in the way
of hi steps.



86:1 bow down thine ear, O lord, hear me: for I am poor and needy.

86:2 preserv my soul; for I am holy: O thou my god, save thi servant
that trusteth in thee.

86:3 Be merci unto me, O lord: for I cri unto thee daily.

86:4 rejoic the soul of thi servant: for unto thee, O lord, do I lift
up my soul.

86:5 for thou, lord, art good, and readi to forgive; and plenteou in
merci unto all them that call upon thee.

86:6 give ear, O lord, unto my prayer; and attend to the voic of my
supplications.

86:7 In the day of my troubl I will call upon thee: for thou wilt
answ me.

86:8 among the god there is none like unto thee, O lord; neither are
ther ani work like unto thi works.

86:9 all nation whom thou hast made shall come and worship before
thee, O lord; and shall glorifi thi name.

86:10 for thou art great, and doest wondrou things: thou art god
alone.

86:11 teach me thi way, O lord; I will walk in thi truth: unit my
heart to fear thi name.

86:12 I will prais thee, O lord my god, with all my heart: and I will
glorifi thi name for evermore.

86:13 for great is thi merci toward me: and thou hast deliv my
soul from the lowest hell.

86:14 O god, the proud are risen against me, and the assembl of
viol men have sought after my soul; and have not set thee before
them.

86:15 but thou, O lord, art a god full of compassion, and gracious,
long suffering, and plenteou in merci and truth.

86:16 O turn unto me, and have merci upon me; give thi strength unto
thi servant, and save the son of thine handmaid.

86:17 shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it,
and be ashamed: becaus thou, lord, hast holpen me, and comfort me.



87:1 hi foundat is in the holi mountains.

87:2 the lord loveth the gate of zion more than all the dwell of
jacob.

87:3 gloriou thing are spoken of thee, O citi of god. selah.

87:4 I will make mention of rahab and babylon to them that know me:
behold philistia, and tyre, with ethiopia; thi man wa born there.

87:5 and of zion it shall be said, thi and that man wa born in her:
and the highest himself shall establish her.

87:6 the lord shall count, when he writeth up the people, that this
man wa born there. selah.

87:7 As well the singer as the player on instrument shall be there:
al my spring are in thee.



88:1 O lord god of my salvation, I have cri day and night before
thee:

88:2 let my prayer come befor thee: inclin thine ear unto my cry;

88:3 for my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto
th grave.

88:4 I am count with them that go down into the pit: I am as a man
that hath no strength:

88:5 free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave, whom
thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thi hand.

88:6 thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.

88:7 thi wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflict me with all
thi waves. selah.

88:8 thou hast put away mine acquaint far from me; thou hast made
m an abomin unto them: I am shut up, and I cannot come forth.

88:9 mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: lord, I have called
daili upon thee, I have stretch out my hand unto thee.

88:10 wilt thou shew wonder to the dead? shall the dead aris and
prais thee? selah.

88:11 shall thi lovingkind be declar in the grave? or thy
faith in destruction?

88:12 shall thi wonder be known in the dark? and thi righteous in
th land of forgetfulness?

88:13 but unto thee have I cried, O lord; and in the morn shall my
pray prevent thee.

88:14 lord, whi castest thou off my soul? whi hidest thou thi face
from me?

88:15 I am afflict and readi to die from my youth up: while I suffer
thi terror I am distracted.

88:16 thi fierc wrath goeth over me; thi terror have cut me off.

88:17 they came round about me daili like water; they compass me
about together.

88:18 lover and friend hast thou put far from me, and mine
acquaint into darkness.



89:1 I will sing of the merci of the lord for ever: with my mouth
wil I make known thi faith to all generations.

89:2 for I have said, merci shall be built up for ever: thy
faith shalt thou establish in the veri heavens.

89:3 I have made a coven with my chosen, I have sworn unto david my
servant,

89:4 thi seed will I establish for ever, and build up thi throne to
al generations. selah.

89:5 and the heaven shall prais thi wonders, O lord: thy
faith also in the congreg of the saints.

89:6 for who in the heaven can be compar unto the lord? who among
th son of the mighti can be liken unto the lord?

89:7 god is greatli to be fear in the assembl of the saints, and to
b had in rever of all them that are about him.

89:8 O lord god of hosts, who is a strong lord like unto thee? or to
thi faith round about thee?

89:9 thou rulest the rage of the sea: when the wave thereof arise,
th stillest them.

89:10 thou hast broken rahab in pieces, as one that is slain; thou
hast scatter thine enemi with thi strong arm.

89:11 the heaven are thine, the earth also is thine: as for the world
and the ful thereof, thou hast found them.

89:12 the north and the south thou hast creat them: tabor and hermon
shal rejoic in thi name.

89:13 thou hast a mighti arm: strong is thi hand, and high is thy
right hand.

89:14 justic and judgment are the habit of thi throne: merci and
truth shall go befor thi face.

89:15 bless is the peopl that know the joy sound: they shall
walk, O lord, in the light of thi countenance.

89:16 In thi name shall they rejoic all the day: and in thy
right shall they be exalted.

89:17 for thou art the glori of their strength: and in thi favour our
horn shall be exalted.

89:18 for the lord is our defence; and the holi one of israel is our
king.

89:19 then thou spakest in vision to thi holi one, and saidst, I have
laid help upon one that is mighty; I have exalt one chosen out of
th people.

89:20 I have found david my servant; with my holi oil have I anointed
him:

89:21 with whom my hand shall be established: mine arm also shall
strengthen him.

89:22 the enemi shall not exact upon him; nor the son of wickedness
afflict him.

89:23 and I will beat down hi foe befor hi face, and plagu them
that hate him.

89:24 but my faith and my merci shall be with him: and in my
nam shall hi horn be exalted.

89:25 I will set hi hand also in the sea, and hi right hand in the
rivers.

89:26 He shall cri unto me, thou art my father, my god, and the rock
of my salvation.

89:27 also I will make him my firstborn, higher than the king of the
earth.

89:28 My merci will I keep for him for evermore, and my coven shall
stand fast with him.

89:29 hi seed also will I make to endur for ever, and hi throne as
th day of heaven.

89:30 If hi children forsak my law, and walk not in my judgments;

89:31 If they break my statutes, and keep not my commandments;

89:32 then will I visit their transgress with the rod, and their
iniqu with stripes.

89:33 nevertheless my lovingkind will I not utterli take from him,
nor suffer my faith to fail.

89:34 My coven will I not break, nor alter the thing that is gone
out of my lips.

89:35 onc have I sworn by my holi that I will not lie unto david.

89:36 hi seed shall endur for ever, and hi throne as the sun before
me.

89:37 It shall be establish for ever as the moon, and as a faithful
wit in heaven. selah.

89:38 but thou hast cast off and abhorred, thou hast been wroth with
thin anointed.

89:39 thou hast made void the coven of thi servant: thou hast
profan hi crown by cast it to the ground.

89:40 thou hast broken down all hi hedges; thou hast brought his
strong hold to ruin.

89:41 all that pass by the way spoil him: he is a reproach to his
neighbours.

89:42 thou hast set up the right hand of hi adversaries; thou hast
mad all hi enemi to rejoice.

89:43 thou hast also turn the edg of hi sword, and hast not made
him to stand in the battle.

89:44 thou hast made hi glori to cease, and cast hi throne down to
th ground.

89:45 the day of hi youth hast thou shortened: thou hast cover him
with shame. selah.

89:46 how long, lord? wilt thou hide thyself for ever? shall thi wrath
burn like fire?

89:47 rememb how short my time is: wherefor hast thou made all men
in vain?

89:48 what man is he that liveth, and shall not see death? shall he
deliv hi soul from the hand of the grave? selah.

89:49 lord, where are thi former lovingkindnesses, which thou swarest
unto david in thi truth?

89:50 remember, lord, the reproach of thi servants; how I do bear in
mi bosom the reproach of all the mighti people;

89:51 wherewith thine enemi have reproached, O lord; wherewith they
hav reproach the footstep of thine anointed.

89:52 bless be the lord for evermore. amen, and amen.



90:1 lord, thou hast been our dwell place in all generations.

90:2 befor the mountain were brought forth, or ever thou hadst
form the earth and the world, even from everlast to everlasting,
th art god.

90:3 thou turnest man to destruction; and sayest, return, ye children
of men.

90:4 for a thousand year in thi sight are but as yesterday when it is
past, and as a watch in the night.

90:5 thou carriest them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in
th morn they are like grass which groweth up.

90:6 In the morn it flourisheth, and groweth up; in the even it
i cut down, and withereth.

90:7 for we are consum by thine anger, and by thi wrath are we
troubled.

90:8 thou hast set our iniqu befor thee, our secret sin in the
light of thi countenance.

90:9 for all our day are pass away in thi wrath: we spend our years
a a tale that is told.

90:10 the day of our year are threescor year and ten; and if by
reason of strength they be fourscor years, yet is their strength
labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off, and we fli away.

90:11 who knoweth the power of thine anger? even accord to thy
fear, so is thi wrath.

90:12 So teach us to number our days, that we may appli our hearts
unto wisdom.

90:13 return, O lord, how long? and let it repent thee concern thy
servants.

90:14 O satisfi us earli with thi mercy; that we may rejoic and be
glad all our days.

90:15 make us glad accord to the day wherein thou hast afflicted
us, and the year wherein we have seen evil.

90:16 let thi work appear unto thi servants, and thi glori unto their
children.

90:17 and let the beauti of the lord our god be upon us: and establish
th the work of our hand upon us; yea, the work of our hands
establish thou it.



91:1 He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most high shall abide
und the shadow of the almighty.

91:2 I will say of the lord, He is my refug and my fortress: my god;
in him will I trust.

91:3 sure he shall deliv thee from the snare of the fowler, and
from the noisom pestilence.

91:4 He shall cover thee with hi feathers, and under hi wing shalt
thou trust: hi truth shall be thi shield and buckler.

91:5 thou shalt not be afraid for the terror by night; nor for the
arrow that flieth by day;

91:6 nor for the pestil that walketh in darkness; nor for the
destruct that wasteth at noonday.

91:7 A thousand shall fall at thi side, and ten thousand at thi right
hand; but it shall not come nigh thee.

91:8 onli with thine eye shalt thou behold and see the reward of the
wicked.

91:9 becaus thou hast made the lord, which is my refuge, even the
most high, thi habitation;

91:10 there shall no evil befal thee, neither shall ani plagu come
nigh thi dwelling.

91:11 for he shall give hi angel charg over thee, to keep thee in
al thi ways.

91:12 they shall bear thee up in their hands, lest thou dash thi foot
against a stone.

91:13 thou shalt tread upon the lion and adder: the young lion and the
dragon shalt thou trampl under feet.

91:14 becaus he hath set hi love upon me, therefor will I deliver
him: I will set him on high, becaus he hath known my name.

91:15 He shall call upon me, and I will answer him: I will be with him
in trouble; I will deliv him, and honour him.

91:16 with long life will I satisfi him, and shew him my salvation.



92:1 It is a good thing to give thank unto the lord, and to sing
prais unto thi name, O most high:

92:2 To shew forth thi lovingkind in the morning, and thy
faith everi night,

92:3 upon an instrument of ten strings, and upon the psaltery; upon
th harp with a solemn sound.

92:4 for thou, lord, hast made me glad through thi work: I will
triumph in the work of thi hands.

92:5 O lord, how great are thi works! and thi thought are veri deep.

92:6 A brutish man knoweth not; neither doth a fool understand this.

92:7 when the wick spring as the grass, and when all the worker of
iniqu do flourish; it is that they shall be destroy for ever:

92:8 but thou, lord, art most high for evermore.

92:9 for, lo, thine enemies, O lord, for, lo, thine enemi shall
perish; all the worker of iniqu shall be scattered.

92:10 but my horn shalt thou exalt like the horn of an unicorn: i
shal be anoint with fresh oil.

92:11 mine eye also shall see my desir on mine enemies, and mine ears
shal hear my desir of the wick that rise up against me.

92:12 the righteou shall flourish like the palm tree: he shall grow
lik a cedar in lebanon.

92:13 those that be plant in the hous of the lord shall flourish in
th court of our god.

92:14 they shall still bring forth fruit in old age; they shall be fat
and flourishing;

92:15 To shew that the lord is upright: he is my rock, and there is no
unright in him.



93:1 the lord reigneth, he is cloth with majesty; the lord is
cloth with strength, wherewith he hath gird himself: the world
also is stablished, that it cannot be moved.

93:2 thi throne is establish of old: thou art from everlasting.

93:3 the flood have lift up, O lord, the flood have lift up
their voice; the flood lift up their waves.

93:4 the lord on high is mightier than the nois of mani waters, yea,
than the mighti wave of the sea.

93:5 thi testimoni are veri sure: holi becometh thine house, o
lord, for ever.



94:1 O lord god, to whom vengeanc belongeth; O god, to whom vengeance
belongeth, shew thyself.

94:2 lift up thyself, thou judg of the earth: render a reward to the
proud.

94:3 lord, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked
triumph?

94:4 how long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the
work of iniqu boast themselves?

94:5 they break in piec thi people, O lord, and afflict thine
heritage.

94:6 they slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

94:7 yet they say, the lord shall not see, neither shall the god of
jacob regard it.

94:8 understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will
y be wise?

94:9 He that plant the ear, shall he not hear? he that form the
eye, shall he not see?

94:10 He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that
teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?

94:11 the lord knoweth the thought of man, that they are vanity.

94:12 bless is the man whom thou chastenest, O lord, and teachest
him out of thi law;

94:13 that thou mayest give him rest from the day of adversity, until
th pit be dig for the wicked.

94:14 for the lord will not cast off hi people, neither will he
forsak hi inheritance.

94:15 but judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the
upright in heart shall follow it.

94:16 who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand
up for me against the worker of iniquity?

94:17 unless the lord had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in
silence.

94:18 when I said, My foot slippeth; thi mercy, O lord, held me up.

94:19 In the multitud of my thought within me thi comfort delight
mi soul.

94:20 shall the throne of iniqu have fellowship with thee, which
frameth mischief by a law?

94:21 they gather themselv togeth against the soul of the
righteous, and condemn the innoc blood.

94:22 but the lord is my defence; and my god is the rock of my refuge.

94:23 and he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut
them off in their own wickedness; yea, the lord our god shall cut them
off.



95:1 O come, let us sing unto the lord: let us make a joy nois to
th rock of our salvation.

95:2 let us come befor hi presenc with thanksgiving, and make a
joy nois unto him with psalms.

95:3 for the lord is a great god, and a great king abov all gods.

95:4 In hi hand are the deep place of the earth: the strength of the
hil is hi also.

95:5 the sea is his, and he made it: and hi hand form the dry
land.

95:6 O come, let us worship and bow down: let us kneel befor the lord
our maker.

95:7 for he is our god; and we are the peopl of hi pasture, and the
sheep of hi hand. To day if ye will hear hi voice,

95:8 harden not your heart, as in the provocation, and as in the day
of temptat in the wilderness:

95:9 when your father tempt me, prove me, and saw my work.

95:10 forti year long wa I griev with thi generation, and said,
it is a peopl that do err in their heart, and they have not known my
ways:

95:11 unto whom I sware in my wrath that they should not enter into my
rest.



96:1 O sing unto the lord a new song: sing unto the lord, all the
earth.

96:2 sing unto the lord, bless hi name; shew forth hi salvat from
day to day.

96:3 declar hi glori among the heathen, hi wonder among all
people.

96:4 for the lord is great, and greatli to be praised: he is to be
fear abov all gods.

96:5 for all the god of the nation are idols: but the lord made the
heavens.

96:6 honour and majesti are befor him: strength and beauti are in his
sanctuary.

96:7 give unto the lord, O ye kindr of the people, give unto the
lord glori and strength.

96:8 give unto the lord the glori due unto hi name: bring an
offering, and come into hi courts.

96:9 O worship the lord in the beauti of holiness: fear befor him,
al the earth.

96:10 say among the heathen that the lord reigneth: the world also
shal be establish that it shall not be moved: he shall judg the
peopl righteously.

96:11 let the heaven rejoice, and let the earth be glad; let the sea
roar, and the ful thereof.

96:12 let the field be joyful, and all that is therein: then shall all
th tree of the wood rejoice

96:13 befor the lord: for he cometh, for he cometh to judg the
earth: he shall judg the world with righteousness, and the people
with hi truth.



97:1 the lord reigneth; let the earth rejoice; let the multitud of
isl be glad thereof.

97:2 cloud and dark are round about him: righteous and
judg are the habit of hi throne.

97:3 A fire goeth befor him, and burneth up hi enemi round about.

97:4 hi lightn enlighten the world: the earth saw, and
trembled.

97:5 the hill melt like wax at the presenc of the lord, at the
pres of the lord of the whole earth.

97:6 the heaven declar hi righteousness, and all the peopl see his
glory.

97:7 confound be all they that serv graven images, that boast
themselv of idols: worship him, all ye gods.

97:8 zion heard, and wa glad; and the daughter of judah rejoiced
becaus of thi judgments, O lord.

97:9 for thou, lord, art high abov all the earth: thou art exalted
far abov all gods.

97:10 Ye that love the lord, hate evil: he preserveth the soul of his
saints; he delivereth them out of the hand of the wicked.

97:11 light is sown for the righteous, and glad for the upright in
heart.

97:12 rejoic in the lord, ye righteous; and give thank at the
remembr of hi holiness.



98:1 O sing unto the lord a new song; for he hath done marvellous
things: hi right hand, and hi holi arm, hath gotten him the victory.

98:2 the lord hath made known hi salvation: hi righteous hath he
openli shew in the sight of the heathen.

98:3 He hath rememb hi merci and hi truth toward the hous of
israel: all the end of the earth have seen the salvat of our god.

98:4 make a joy nois unto the lord, all the earth: make a loud
noise, and rejoice, and sing praise.

98:5 sing unto the lord with the harp; with the harp, and the voic of
a psalm.

98:6 with trumpet and sound of cornet make a joy nois befor the
lord, the king.

98:7 let the sea roar, and the ful thereof; the world, and they
that dwell therein.

98:8 let the flood clap their hands: let the hill be joy together

98:9 befor the lord; for he cometh to judg the earth: with
right shall he judg the world, and the peopl with equity.



99:1 the lord reigneth; let the peopl tremble: he sitteth between the
cherubims; let the earth be moved.

99:2 the lord is great in zion; and he is high abov all the people.

99:3 let them prais thi great and terribl name; for it is holy.

99:4 the king' strength also loveth judgment; thou dost establish
equity, thou executest judgment and righteous in jacob.

99:5 exalt ye the lord our god, and worship at hi footstool; for he
i holy.

99:6 mose and aaron among hi priests, and samuel among them that
cal upon hi name; they call upon the lord, and he answer them.

99:7 He spake unto them in the cloudi pillar: they kept his
testimonies, and the ordin that he gave them.

99:8 thou answeredst them, O lord our god: thou wast a god that
forgavest them, though thou tookest vengeanc of their inventions.

99:9 exalt the lord our god, and worship at hi holi hill; for the
lord our god is holy.



100:1 make a joy nois unto the lord, all ye lands.

100:2 serv the lord with gladness: come befor hi presenc with
singing.

100:3 know ye that the lord he is god: it is he that hath made us, and
not we ourselves; we are hi people, and the sheep of hi pasture.

100:4 enter into hi gate with thanksgiving, and into hi court with
praise: be thank unto him, and bless hi name.

100:5 for the lord is good; hi merci is everlasting; and hi truth
endureth to all generations.



101:1 I will sing of merci and judgment: unto thee, O lord, will i
sing.

101:2 I will behav myself wise in a perfect way. O when wilt thou
com unto me? I will walk within my hous with a perfect heart.

101:3 I will set no wick thing befor mine eyes: I hate the work of
them that turn aside; it shall not cleav to me.

101:4 A froward heart shall depart from me: I will not know a wicked
person.

101:5 whoso privili slandereth hi neighbour, him will I cut off: him
that hath an high look and a proud heart will not I suffer.

101:6 mine eye shall be upon the faith of the land, that they may
dwel with me: he that walketh in a perfect way, he shall serv me.

101:7 He that worketh deceit shall not dwell within my house: he that
telleth lie shall not tarri in my sight.

101:8 I will earli destroy all the wick of the land; that I may cut
