off all wick doer from the citi of the lord.



102:1 hear my prayer, O lord, and let my cri come unto thee.

102:2 hide not thi face from me in the day when I am in trouble;
inclin thine ear unto me: in the day when I call answer me speedily.

102:3 for my day are consum like smoke, and my bone are burn as
an hearth.

102:4 My heart is smitten, and wither like grass; so that I forget
to eat my bread.

102:5 By reason of the voic of my groan my bone cleav to my
skin.

102:6 I am like a pelican of the wilderness: I am like an owl of the
desert.

102:7 I watch, and am as a sparrow alon upon the hous top.

102:8 mine enemi reproach me all the day; and they that are mad
against me are sworn against me.

102:9 for I have eaten ash like bread, and mingl my drink with
weeping.

102:10 becaus of thine indign and thi wrath: for thou hast
lift me up, and cast me down.

102:11 My day are like a shadow that declineth; and I am withered
lik grass.

102:12 but thou, O lord, shall endur for ever; and thi remembrance
unto all generations.

102:13 thou shalt arise, and have merci upon zion: for the time to
favour her, yea, the set time, is come.

102:14 for thi servant take pleasur in her stones, and favour the
dust thereof.

102:15 So the heathen shall fear the name of the lord, and all the
k of the earth thi glory.

102:16 when the lord shall build up zion, he shall appear in his
glory.

102:17 He will regard the prayer of the destitute, and not despise
their prayer.

102:18 thi shall be written for the gener to come: and the
peopl which shall be creat shall prais the lord.

102:19 for he hath look down from the height of hi sanctuary; from
heaven did the lord behold the earth;

102:20 To hear the groan of the prisoner; to loos those that are
appoint to death;

102:21 To declar the name of the lord in zion, and hi prais in
jerusalem;

102:22 when the peopl are gather together, and the kingdoms, to
serv the lord.

102:23 He weaken my strength in the way; he shorten my days.

102:24 I said, O my god, take me not away in the midst of my days: thy
year are throughout all generations.

102:25 Of old hast thou laid the foundat of the earth: and the
heaven are the work of thi hands.

102:26 they shall perish, but thou shalt endure: yea, all of them
shal wax old like a garment; as a vestur shalt thou chang them, and
they shall be changed:

102:27 but thou art the same, and thi year shall have no end.

102:28 the children of thi servant shall continue, and their seed
shal be establish befor thee.



103:1 bless the lord, O my soul: and all that is within me, bless his
holi name.

103:2 bless the lord, O my soul, and forget not all hi benefits:

103:3 who forgiveth all thine iniquities; who healeth all thy
diseases;

103:4 who redeemeth thi life from destruction; who crowneth thee with
lovingkind and tender mercies;

103:5 who satisfieth thi mouth with good things; so that thi youth is
renew like the eagle's.

103:6 the lord executeth righteous and judgment for all that are
oppressed.

103:7 He made known hi way unto moses, hi act unto the children of
israel.

103:8 the lord is merci and gracious, slow to anger, and plenteous
in mercy.

103:9 He will not alway chide: neither will he keep hi anger for
ever.

103:10 He hath not dealt with us after our sins; nor reward us
accord to our iniquities.

103:11 for as the heaven is high abov the earth, so great is his
merci toward them that fear him.

103:12 As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he remov our
transgress from us.

103:13 like as a father pitieth hi children, so the lord pitieth them
that fear him.

103:14 for he knoweth our frame; he remembereth that we are dust.

103:15 As for man, hi day are as grass: as a flower of the field, so
h flourisheth.

103:16 for the wind passeth over it, and it is gone; and the place
thereof shall know it no more.

103:17 but the merci of the lord is from everlast to everlasting
upon them that fear him, and hi righteous unto children's
children;

103:18 To such as keep hi covenant, and to those that rememb his
command to do them.

103:19 the lord hath prepar hi throne in the heavens; and his
kingdom ruleth over all.

103:20 bless the lord, ye hi angels, that excel in strength, that do
hi commandments, hearken unto the voic of hi word.

103:21 bless ye the lord, all ye hi hosts; ye minist of his, that
do hi pleasure.

103:22 bless the lord, all hi work in all place of hi dominion:
bless the lord, O my soul.



104:1 bless the lord, O my soul. O lord my god, thou art veri great;
thou art cloth with honour and majesty.

104:2 who coverest thyself with light as with a garment: who
stretchest out the heaven like a curtain:

104:3 who layeth the beam of hi chamber in the waters: who maketh
th cloud hi chariot: who walketh upon the wing of the wind:

104:4 who maketh hi angel spirits; hi minist a flame fire:

104:5 who laid the foundat of the earth, that it should not be
remov for ever.

104:6 thou coveredst it with the deep as with a garment: the waters
stood abov the mountains.

104:7 At thi rebuk they fled; at the voic of thi thunder they hasted
away.

104:8 they go up by the mountains; they go down by the valley unto
th place which thou hast found for them.

104:9 thou hast set a bound that they may not pass over; that they
turn not again to cover the earth.

104:10 He sendeth the spring into the valleys, which run among the
hills.

104:11 they give drink to everi beast of the field: the wild asses
quench their thirst.

104:12 By them shall the fowl of the heaven have their habitation,
which sing among the branches.

104:13 He watereth the hill from hi chambers: the earth is satisfied
with the fruit of thi works.

104:14 He causeth the grass to grow for the cattle, and herb for the
servic of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;

104:15 and wine that maketh glad the heart of man, and oil to make his
fac to shine, and bread which strengtheneth man' heart.

104:16 the tree of the lord are full of sap; the cedar of lebanon,
which he hath planted;

104:17 where the bird make their nests: as for the stork, the fir
tre are her house.

104:18 the high hill are a refug for the wild goats; and the rocks
for the conies.

104:19 He appoint the moon for seasons: the sun knoweth hi going
down.

104:20 thou makest darkness, and it is night: wherein all the beasts
of the forest do creep forth.

104:21 the young lion roar after their prey, and seek their meat from
god.

104:22 the sun ariseth, they gather themselv together, and lay them
down in their dens.

104:23 man goeth forth unto hi work and to hi labour until the
evening.

104:24 O lord, how manifold are thi works! in wisdom hast thou made
them all: the earth is full of thi riches.

104:25 So is thi great and wide sea, wherein are thing creeping
innumerable, both small and great beasts.

104:26 there go the ships: there is that leviathan, whom thou hast
mad to play therein.

104:27 these wait all upon thee; that thou mayest give them their meat
in due season.

104:28 that thou givest them they gather: thou openest thine hand,
they are fill with good.

104:29 thou hidest thi face, they are troubled: thou takest away their
breath, they die, and return to their dust.

104:30 thou sendest forth thi spirit, they are created: and thou
renewest the face of the earth.

104:31 the glori of the lord shall endur for ever: the lord shall
rejoic in hi works.

104:32 He looketh on the earth, and it trembleth: he toucheth the
hills, and they smoke.

104:33 I will sing unto the lord as long as I live: I will sing praise
to my god while I have my being.

104:34 My medit of him shall be sweet: I will be glad in the
lord.

104:35 let the sinner be consum out of the earth, and let the
wick be no more. bless thou the lord, O my soul. prais ye the lord.



105:1 O give thank unto the lord; call upon hi name: make known his
de among the people.

105:2 sing unto him, sing psalm unto him: talk ye of all hi wondrous
works.

105:3 glori ye in hi holi name: let the heart of them rejoic that
seek the lord.

105:4 seek the lord, and hi strength: seek hi face evermore.

105:5 rememb hi marvel work that he hath done; hi wonders,
and the judgment of hi mouth;

105:6 O ye seed of abraham hi servant, ye children of jacob his
chosen.

105:7 He is the lord our god: hi judgment are in all the earth.

105:8 He hath rememb hi coven for ever, the word which he
command to a thousand generations.

105:9 which coven he made with abraham, and hi oath unto isaac;

105:10 and confirm the same unto jacob for a law, and to israel for
an everlast covenant:

105:11 saying, unto thee will I give the land of canaan, the lot of
your inheritance:

105:12 when they were but a few men in number; yea, veri few, and
strang in it.

105:13 when they went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to
anoth people;

105:14 He suffer no man to do them wrong: yea, he reprov king for
their sakes;

105:15 saying, touch not mine anointed, and do my prophet no harm.

105:16 moreov he call for a famin upon the land: he brake the
whol staff of bread.

105:17 He sent a man befor them, even joseph, who wa sold for a
servant:

105:18 whose feet they hurt with fetters: he wa laid in iron:

105:19 until the time that hi word came: the word of the lord tried
him.

105:20 the king sent and loos him; even the ruler of the people, and
let him go free.

105:21 He made him lord of hi house, and ruler of all hi substance:

105:22 To bind hi princ at hi pleasure; and teach hi senators
wisdom.

105:23 israel also came into egypt; and jacob sojourn in the land of
ham.

105:24 and he increas hi peopl greatly; and made them stronger
than their enemies.

105:25 He turn their heart to hate hi people, to deal subtilli with
hi servants.

105:26 He sent mose hi servant; and aaron whom he had chosen.

105:27 they shew hi sign among them, and wonder in the land of
ham.

105:28 He sent darkness, and made it dark; and they rebel not
against hi word.

105:29 He turn their water into blood, and slew their fish.

105:30 their land brought forth frog in abundance, in the chamber of
their kings.

105:31 He spake, and there came diver sort of flies, and lice in all
their coasts.

105:32 He gave them hail for rain, and flame fire in their land.

105:33 He smote their vine also and their fig trees; and brake the
tre of their coasts.

105:34 He spake, and the locust came, and caterpillers, and that
without number,

105:35 and did eat up all the herb in their land, and devour the
fruit of their ground.

105:36 He smote also all the firstborn in their land, the chief of all
their strength.

105:37 He brought them forth also with silver and gold: and there was
not one feebl person among their tribes.

105:38 egypt wa glad when they departed: for the fear of them fell
upon them.

105:39 He spread a cloud for a covering; and fire to give light in the
night.

105:40 the peopl asked, and he brought quails, and satisfi them
with the bread of heaven.

105:41 He open the rock, and the water gush out; they ran in the
dri place like a river.

105:42 for he rememb hi holi promise, and abraham hi servant.

105:43 and he brought forth hi peopl with joy, and hi chosen with
gladness:

105:44 and gave them the land of the heathen: and they inherit the
labour of the people;

105:45 that they might observ hi statutes, and keep hi laws. praise
y the lord.



106:1 prais ye the lord. O give thank unto the lord; for he is good:
for hi merci endureth for ever.

106:2 who can utter the mighti act of the lord? who can shew forth
al hi praise?

106:3 bless are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth
right at all times.

106:4 rememb me, O lord, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy
people: O visit me with thi salvation;

106:5 that I may see the good of thi chosen, that I may rejoic in the
glad of thi nation, that I may glori with thine inheritance.

106:6 We have sin with our fathers, we have commit iniquity, we
hav done wickedly.

106:7 our father understood not thi wonder in egypt; they remembered
not the multitud of thi mercies; but provok him at the sea, even at
th red sea.

106:8 nevertheless he save them for hi name' sake, that he might
mak hi mighti power to be known.

106:9 He rebuk the red sea also, and it wa dri up: so he led them
through the depths, as through the wilderness.

106:10 and he save them from the hand of him that hate them, and
redeem them from the hand of the enemy.

106:11 and the water cover their enemies: there wa not one of them
left.

106:12 then believ they hi words; they sang hi praise.

106:13 they soon forgat hi works; they wait not for hi counsel:

106:14 but lust exceedingli in the wilderness, and tempt god in
th desert.

106:15 and he gave them their request; but sent lean into their
soul.

106:16 they envi mose also in the camp, and aaron the saint of the
lord.

106:17 the earth open and swallow up dathan and cover the
compani of abiram.

106:18 and a fire wa kindl in their company; the flame burn up
th wicked.

106:19 they made a calf in horeb, and worship the molten image.

106:20 thu they chang their glori into the similitud of an ox that
eateth grass.

106:21 they forgat god their saviour, which had done great thing in
egypt;

106:22 wondrou work in the land of ham, and terribl thing by the
r sea.

106:23 therefor he said that he would destroy them, had not mose his
chosen stood befor him in the breach, to turn away hi wrath, lest he
should destroy them.

106:24 yea, they despis the pleasant land, they believ not his
word:

106:25 but murmur in their tents, and hearken not unto the voice
of the lord.

106:26 therefor he lift up hi hand against them, to overthrow them
in the wilderness:

106:27 To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter
them in the lands.

106:28 they join themselv also unto baalpeor, and ate the
sacrific of the dead.

106:29 thu they provok him to anger with their inventions: and the
plagu brake in upon them.

106:30 then stood up phinehas, and execut judgment: and so the
plagu wa stayed.

106:31 and that wa count unto him for righteous unto all
gener for evermore.

106:32 they anger him also at the water of strife, so that it went
il with mose for their sakes:

106:33 becaus they provok hi spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly
with hi lips.

106:34 they did not destroy the nations, concern whom the lord
command them:

106:35 but were mingl among the heathen, and learn their works.

106:36 and they serv their idols: which were a snare unto them.

106:37 yea, they sacrif their son and their daughter unto
devils,

106:38 and shed innoc blood, even the blood of their son and of
their daughters, whom they sacrif unto the idol of canaan: and
th land wa pollut with blood.

106:39 thu were they defil with their own works, and went a whoring
with their own inventions.

106:40 therefor wa the wrath of the lord kindl against hi people,
insomuch that he abhor hi own inheritance.

106:41 and he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that
hat them rule over them.

106:42 their enemi also oppress them, and they were brought into
subject under their hand.

106:43 mani time did he deliv them; but they provok him with
their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

106:44 nevertheless he regard their affliction, when he heard their
cry:

106:45 and he rememb for them hi covenant, and repent according
to the multitud of hi mercies.

106:46 He made them also to be piti of all those that carri them
captives.

106:47 save us, O lord our god, and gather us from among the heathen,
to give thank unto thi holi name, and to triumph in thi praise.

106:48 bless be the lord god of israel from everlast to
everlasting: and let all the peopl say, amen. prais ye the lord.



107:1 O give thank unto the lord, for he is good: for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

107:2 let the redeem of the lord say so, whom he hath redeem from
th hand of the enemy;

107:3 and gather them out of the lands, from the east, and from the
west, from the north, and from the south.

107:4 they wander in the wilder in a solitari way; they found no
citi to dwell in.

107:5 hungri and thirsty, their soul faint in them.

107:6 then they cri unto the lord in their trouble, and he delivered
them out of their distresses.

107:7 and he led them forth by the right way, that they might go to a
citi of habitation.

107:8 Oh that men would prais the lord for hi goodness, and for his
wond work to the children of men!

107:9 for he satisfieth the long soul, and filleth the hungri soul
with goodness.

107:10 such as sit in dark and in the shadow of death, be bound
in afflict and iron;

107:11 becaus they rebel against the word of god, and contemned
th counsel of the most high:

107:12 therefor he brought down their heart with labour; they fell
down, and there wa none to help.

107:13 then they cri unto the lord in their trouble, and he saved
them out of their distresses.

107:14 He brought them out of dark and the shadow of death, and
brak their band in sunder.

107:15 Oh that men would prais the lord for hi goodness, and for his
wond work to the children of men!

107:16 for he hath broken the gate of brass, and cut the bar of iron
in sunder.

107:17 fool becaus of their transgression, and becaus of their
iniquities, are afflicted.

107:18 their soul abhorreth all manner of meat; and they draw near
unto the gate of death.

107:19 then they cri unto the lord in their trouble, and he saveth
them out of their distresses.

107:20 He sent hi word, and heal them, and deliv them from
their destructions.

107:21 Oh that men would prais the lord for hi goodness, and for his
wond work to the children of men!

107:22 and let them sacrific the sacrific of thanksgiving, and
declar hi work with rejoicing.

107:23 they that go down to the sea in ships, that do busi in
great waters;

107:24 these see the work of the lord, and hi wonder in the deep.

107:25 for he commandeth, and raiseth the stormi wind, which lifteth
up the wave thereof.

107:26 they mount up to the heaven, they go down again to the depths:
their soul is melt becaus of trouble.

107:27 they reel to and fro, and stagger like a drunken man, and are
at their wit' end.

107:28 then they cri unto the lord in their trouble, and he bringeth
them out of their distresses.

107:29 He maketh the storm a calm, so that the wave thereof are
still.

107:30 then are they glad becaus they be quiet; so he bringeth them
unto their desir haven.

107:31 Oh that men would prais the lord for hi goodness, and for his
wond work to the children of men!

107:32 let them exalt him also in the congreg of the people, and
prais him in the assembl of the elders.

107:33 He turneth river into a wilderness, and the waterspr into
dri ground;

107:34 A fruit land into barrenness, for the wicked of them
that dwell therein.

107:35 He turneth the wilder into a stand water, and dri ground
into watersprings.

107:36 and there he maketh the hungri to dwell, that they may prepare
a citi for habitation;

107:37 and sow the fields, and plant vineyards, which may yield fruits
of increase.

107:38 He blesseth them also, so that they are multipli greatly; and
suffereth not their cattl to decrease.

107:39 again, they are minish and brought low through oppression,
affliction, and sorrow.

107:40 He poureth contempt upon princes, and causeth them to wander in
th wilderness, where there is no way.

107:41 yet setteth he the poor on high from affliction, and maketh him
famili like a flock.

107:42 the righteou shall see it, and rejoice: and all iniqu shall
stop her mouth.

107:43 whoso is wise, and will observ these things, even they shall
understand the lovingkind of the lord.



108:1 O god, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with
mi glory.

108:2 awake, psalteri and harp: I myself will awak early.

108:3 I will prais thee, O lord, among the people: and I will sing
prais unto thee among the nations.

108:4 for thi merci is great abov the heavens: and thi truth reacheth
unto the clouds.

108:5 Be thou exalted, O god, abov the heavens: and thi glori above
al the earth;

108:6 that thi belov may be delivered: save with thi right hand, and
answ me.

108:7 god hath spoken in hi holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide
shechem, and mete out the valley of succoth.

108:8 gilead is mine; manasseh is mine; ephraim also is the strength
of mine head; judah is my lawgiver;

108:9 moab is my washpot; over edom will I cast out my shoe; over
philistia will I triumph.

108:10 who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into
edom?

108:11 wilt not thou, O god, who hast cast us off? and wilt not thou,
o god, go forth with our hosts?

108:12 give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.

108:13 through god we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall
tread down our enemies.



109:1 hold not thi peace, O god of my praise;

109:2 for the mouth of the wick and the mouth of the deceit are
open against me: they have spoken against me with a lie tongue.

109:3 they compass me about also with word of hatred; and fought
against me without a cause.

109:4 for my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto
prayer.

109:5 and they have reward me evil for good, and hatr for my love.

109:6 set thou a wick man over him: and let satan stand at hi right
hand.

109:7 when he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his
pray becom sin.

109:8 let hi day be few; and let anoth take hi office.

109:9 let hi children be fatherless, and hi wife a widow.

109:10 let hi children be continu vagabonds, and beg: let them
seek their bread also out of their desol places.

109:11 let the extortion catch all that he hath; and let the
strang spoil hi labour.

109:12 let there be none to extend merci unto him: neither let there
b ani to favour hi fatherless children.

109:13 let hi poster be cut off; and in the gener following
let their name be blot out.

109:14 let the iniqu of hi father be rememb with the lord;
and let not the sin of hi mother be blot out.

109:15 let them be befor the lord continually, that he may cut off
th memori of them from the earth.

109:16 becaus that he rememb not to shew mercy, but persecuted
th poor and needi man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

109:17 As he love cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted
not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

109:18 As he cloth himself with curs like as with hi garment, so
let it come into hi bowel like water, and like oil into hi bones.

109:19 let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a
girdl wherewith he is gird continually.

109:20 let thi be the reward of mine adversari from the lord, and
of them that speak evil against my soul.

109:21 but do thou for me, O god the lord, for thi name' sake:
becaus thi merci is good, deliv thou me.

109:22 for I am poor and needy, and my heart is wound within me.

109:23 I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am toss up and
down as the locust.

109:24 My knee are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of
fatness.

109:25 I becam also a reproach unto them: when they look upon me
they shake their heads.

109:26 help me, O lord my god: O save me accord to thi mercy:

109:27 that they may know that thi is thi hand; that thou, lord, hast
don it.

109:28 let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be
ashamed; but let thi servant rejoice.

109:29 let mine adversari be cloth with shame, and let them cover
themselv with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

109:30 I will greatli prais the lord with my mouth; yea, I will
prais him among the multitude.

109:31 for he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him
from those that condemn hi soul.



110:1 the lord said unto my lord, sit thou at my right hand, until i
mak thine enemi thi footstool.

110:2 the lord shall send the rod of thi strength out of zion: rule
th in the midst of thine enemies.

110:3 thi peopl shall be will in the day of thi power, in the
beauti of holi from the womb of the morning: thou hast the dew
of thi youth.

110:4 the lord hath sworn, and will not repent, thou art a priest for
ev after the order of melchizedek.

110:5 the lord at thi right hand shall strike through king in the day
of hi wrath.

110:6 He shall judg among the heathen, he shall fill the place with
th dead bodies; he shall wound the head over mani countries.

110:7 He shall drink of the brook in the way: therefor shall he lift
up the head.



111:1 prais ye the lord. I will prais the lord with my whole heart,
in the assembl of the upright, and in the congregation.

111:2 the work of the lord are great, sought out of all them that
hav pleasur therein.

111:3 hi work is honour and glorious: and hi righteousness
endureth for ever.

111:4 He hath made hi wonder work to be remembered: the lord is
graci and full of compassion.

111:5 He hath given meat unto them that fear him: he will ever be
mind of hi covenant.

111:6 He hath shew hi peopl the power of hi works, that he may
giv them the heritag of the heathen.

111:7 the work of hi hand are veriti and judgment; all his
command are sure.

111:8 they stand fast for ever and ever, and are done in truth and
uprightness.

111:9 He sent redempt unto hi people: he hath command his
coven for ever: holi and reverend is hi name.

111:10 the fear of the lord is the begin of wisdom: a good
understand have all they that do hi commandments: hi praise
endureth for ever.



112:1 prais ye the lord. bless is the man that feareth the lord,
that delighteth greatli in hi commandments.

112:2 hi seed shall be mighti upon earth: the gener of the
upright shall be blessed.

112:3 wealth and rich shall be in hi house: and hi righteousness
endureth for ever.

112:4 unto the upright there ariseth light in the darkness: he is
gracious, and full of compassion, and righteous.

112:5 A good man sheweth favour, and lendeth: he will guid his
affair with discretion.

112:6 sure he shall not be move for ever: the righteou shall be in
everlast remembrance.

112:7 He shall not be afraid of evil tidings: hi heart is fixed,
trust in the lord.

112:8 hi heart is established, he shall not be afraid, until he see
hi desir upon hi enemies.

112:9 He hath dispersed, he hath given to the poor; hi righteousness
endureth for ever; hi horn shall be exalt with honour.

112:10 the wick shall see it, and be grieved; he shall gnash with
hi teeth, and melt away: the desir of the wick shall perish.



113:1 prais ye the lord. praise, O ye servant of the lord, praise
th name of the lord.

113:2 bless be the name of the lord from thi time forth and for
evermore.

113:3 from the rise of the sun unto the go down of the same the
lord' name is to be praised.

113:4 the lord is high abov all nations, and hi glori abov the
heavens.

113:5 who is like unto the lord our god, who dwelleth on high,

113:6 who humbleth himself to behold the thing that are in heaven,
and in the earth!

113:7 He raiseth up the poor out of the dust, and lifteth the needy
out of the dunghill;

113:8 that he may set him with princes, even with the princ of his
people.

113:9 He maketh the barren woman to keep house, and to be a joyful
moth of children. prais ye the lord.



114:1 when israel went out of egypt, the hous of jacob from a people
of strang language;

114:2 judah wa hi sanctuary, and israel hi dominion.

114:3 the sea saw it, and fled: jordan wa driven back.

114:4 the mountain skip like rams, and the littl hill like
lambs.

114:5 what ail thee, O thou sea, that thou fleddest? thou jordan,
that thou wast driven back?

114:6 Ye mountains, that ye skip like rams; and ye littl hills,
lik lambs?

114:7 tremble, thou earth, at the presenc of the lord, at the
pres of the god of jacob;

114:8 which turn the rock into a stand water, the flint into a
fountain of waters.



115:1 not unto us, O lord, not unto us, but unto thi name give glory,
for thi mercy, and for thi truth' sake.

115:2 wherefor should the heathen say, where is now their god?

115:3 but our god is in the heavens: he hath done whatsoev he hath
pleased.

115:4 their idol are silver and gold, the work of men' hands.

115:5 they have mouths, but they speak not: eye have they, but they
se not:

115:6 they have ears, but they hear not: nose have they, but they
smel not:

115:7 they have hands, but they handl not: feet have they, but they
walk not: neither speak they through their throat.

115:8 they that make them are like unto them; so is everi one that
trusteth in them.

115:9 O israel, trust thou in the lord: he is their help and their
shield.

115:10 O hous of aaron, trust in the lord: he is their help and their
shield.

115:11 Ye that fear the lord, trust in the lord: he is their help and
their shield.

115:12 the lord hath been mind of us: he will bless us; he will
bless the hous of israel; he will bless the hous of aaron.

115:13 He will bless them that fear the lord, both small and great.

115:14 the lord shall increas you more and more, you and your
children.

115:15 Ye are bless of the lord which made heaven and earth.

115:16 the heaven, even the heavens, are the lord's: but the earth
hath he given to the children of men.

115:17 the dead prais not the lord, neither ani that go down into
silence.

115:18 but we will bless the lord from thi time forth and for
evermore.

prais the lord.



116:1 I love the lord, becaus he hath heard my voic and my
supplications.

116:2 becaus he hath inclin hi ear unto me, therefor will I call
upon him as long as I live.

116:3 the sorrow of death compass me, and the pain of hell gat
hold upon me: I found troubl and sorrow.

116:4 then call I upon the name of the lord; O lord, I beseech thee,
deliv my soul.

116:5 graciou is the lord, and righteous; yea, our god is merciful.

116:6 the lord preserveth the simple: I wa brought low, and he helped
me.

116:7 return unto thi rest, O my soul; for the lord hath dealt
bounti with thee.

116:8 for thou hast deliv my soul from death, mine eye from
tears, and my feet from falling.

116:9 I will walk befor the lord in the land of the living.

116:10 I believed, therefor have I spoken: I wa greatli afflicted:

116:11 I said in my haste, all men are liars.

116:12 what shall I render unto the lord for all hi benefit toward
me?

116:13 I will take the cup of salvation, and call upon the name of the
lord.

116:14 I will pay my vow unto the lord now in the presenc of all his
people.

116:15 preciou in the sight of the lord is the death of hi saints.

116:16 O lord, truli I am thi servant; I am thi servant, and the son
of thine handmaid: thou hast loos my bonds.

116:17 I will offer to thee the sacrific of thanksgiving, and will
cal upon the name of the lord.

116:18 I will pay my vow unto the lord now in the presenc of all his
people.

116:19 In the court of the lord' house, in the midst of thee, o
jerusalem. prais ye the lord.



117:1 O prais the lord, all ye nations: prais him, all ye people.

117:2 for hi merci kind is great toward us: and the truth of
th lord endureth for ever. prais ye the lord.



118:1 O give thank unto the lord; for he is good: becaus hi mercy
endureth for ever.

118:2 let israel now say, that hi merci endureth for ever.

118:3 let the hous of aaron now say, that hi merci endureth for
ever.

118:4 let them now that fear the lord say, that hi merci endureth for
ever.

118:5 I call upon the lord in distress: the lord answer me, and
set me in a larg place.

118:6 the lord is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto
me?

118:7 the lord taketh my part with them that help me: therefor shall
i see my desir upon them that hate me.

118:8 It is better to trust in the lord than to put confid in man.

118:9 It is better to trust in the lord than to put confid in
princes.

118:10 all nation compass me about: but in the name of the lord
wil I destroy them.

118:11 they compass me about; yea, they compass me about: but in
th name of the lord I will destroy them.

118:12 they compass me about like bees: they are quench as the
fir of thorns: for in the name of the lord I will destroy them.

118:13 thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the lord
help me.

118:14 the lord is my strength and song, and is becom my salvation.

118:15 the voic of rejoic and salvat is in the tabernacl of
th righteous: the right hand of the lord doeth valiantly.

118:16 the right hand of the lord is exalted: the right hand of the
lord doeth valiantly.

118:17 I shall not die, but live, and declar the work of the lord.

118:18 the lord hath chasten me sore: but he hath not given me over
unto death.

118:19 open to me the gate of righteousness: I will go into them, and
i will prais the lord:

118:20 thi gate of the lord, into which the righteou shall enter.

118:21 I will prais thee: for thou hast heard me, and art becom my
salvation.

118:22 the stone which the builder refus is becom the head stone
of the corner.

118:23 thi is the lord' doing; it is marvel in our eyes.

118:24 thi is the day which the lord hath made; we will rejoic and
b glad in it.

118:25 save now, I beseech thee, O lord: O lord, I beseech thee, send
now prosperity.

118:26 bless be he that cometh in the name of the lord: we have
bless you out of the hous of the lord.

118:27 god is the lord, which hath shew us light: bind the sacrifice
with cords, even unto the horn of the altar.

118:28 thou art my god, and I will prais thee: thou art my god, i
wil exalt thee.

118:29 O give thank unto the lord; for he is good: for hi mercy
endureth for ever.



119:1 bless are the undefil in the way, who walk in the law of the
lord.

119:2 bless are they that keep hi testimonies, and that seek him
with the whole heart.

119:3 they also do no iniquity: they walk in hi ways.

119:4 thou hast command us to keep thi precept diligently.

119:5 O that my way were direct to keep thi statutes!

119:6 then shall I not be ashamed, when I have respect unto all thy
commandments.

119:7 I will prais thee with upright of heart, when I shall have
learn thi righteou judgments.

119:8 I will keep thi statutes: O forsak me not utterly.

119:9 wherewith shall a young man cleans hi way? by take heed
thereto accord to thi word.

119:10 with my whole heart have I sought thee: O let me not wander
from thi commandments.

119:11 thi word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against
thee.

119:12 bless art thou, O lord: teach me thi statutes.

119:13 with my lip have I declar all the judgment of thi mouth.

119:14 I have rejoic in the way of thi testimonies, as much as in
al riches.

119:15 I will medit in thi precepts, and have respect unto thy
ways.

119:16 I will delight myself in thi statutes: I will not forget thy
word.

119:17 deal bounti with thi servant, that I may live, and keep
thi word.

119:18 open thou mine eyes, that I may behold wondrou thing out of
thi law.

119:19 I am a stranger in the earth: hide not thi command from
me.

119:20 My soul breaketh for the long that it hath unto thy
judg at all times.

119:21 thou hast rebuk the proud that are cursed, which do err from
thi commandments.

119:22 remov from me reproach and contempt; for I have kept thy
testimonies.

119:23 princ also did sit and speak against me: but thi servant did
medit in thi statutes.

119:24 thi testimoni also are my delight and my counsellors.

119:25 My soul cleaveth unto the dust: quicken thou me accord to
thi word.

119:26 I have declar my ways, and thou heardest me: teach me thy
statutes.

119:27 make me to understand the way of thi precepts: so shall I talk
of thi wondrou works.

119:28 My soul melteth for heaviness: strengthen thou me according
unto thi word.

119:29 remov from me the way of lying: and grant me thi law
graciously.

119:30 I have chosen the way of truth: thi judgment have I laid
befor me.

119:31 I have stuck unto thi testimonies: O lord, put me not to shame.

119:32 I will run the way of thi commandments, when thou shalt enlarge
mi heart.

119:33 teach me, O lord, the way of thi statutes; and I shall keep it
unto the end.

119:34 give me understanding, and I shall keep thi law; yea, I shall
observ it with my whole heart.

119:35 make me to go in the path of thi commandments; for therein do i
delight.

119:36 inclin my heart unto thi testimonies, and not to covetousness.

119:37 turn away mine eye from behold vanity; and quicken thou me
in thi way.

119:38 stablish thi word unto thi servant, who is devot to thi fear.

119:39 turn away my reproach which I fear: for thi judgment are good.

119:40 behold, I have long after thi precepts: quicken me in thy
righteousness.

119:41 let thi merci come also unto me, O lord, even thi salvation,
accord to thi word.

119:42 So shall I have wherewith to answer him that reproacheth me:
for I trust in thi word.

119:43 and take not the word of truth utterli out of my mouth; for i
hav hope in thi judgments.

119:44 So shall I keep thi law continu for ever and ever.

119:45 and I will walk at liberty: for I seek thi precepts.

119:46 I will speak of thi testimoni also befor kings, and will not
b ashamed.

119:47 and I will delight myself in thi commandments, which I have
loved.

119:48 My hand also will I lift up unto thi commandments, which i
hav loved; and I will medit in thi statutes.

119:49 rememb the word unto thi servant, upon which thou hast caused
m to hope.

119:50 thi is my comfort in my affliction: for thi word hath
quicken me.

119:51 the proud have had me greatli in derision: yet have I not
declin from thi law.

119:52 I rememb thi judgment of old, O lord; and have comforted
myself.

119:53 horror hath taken hold upon me becaus of the wick that
forsak thi law.

119:54 thi statut have been my song in the hous of my pilgrimage.

119:55 I have rememb thi name, O lord, in the night, and have kept
thi law.

119:56 thi I had, becaus I kept thi precepts.

119:57 thou art my portion, O lord: I have said that I would keep thy
words.

119:58 I intreat thi favour with my whole heart: be merci unto me
accord to thi word.

119:59 I thought on my ways, and turn my feet unto thi testimonies.

119:60 I made haste, and delay not to keep thi commandments.

119:61 the band of the wick have rob me: but I have not
forgotten thi law.

119:62 At midnight I will rise to give thank unto thee becaus of thy
right judgments.

119:63 I am a companion of all them that fear thee, and of them that
keep thi precepts.

119:64 the earth, O lord, is full of thi mercy: teach me thi statutes.

119:65 thou hast dealt well with thi servant, O lord, accord unto
thi word.

119:66 teach me good judgment and knowledge: for I have believ thy
commandments.

119:67 befor I wa afflict I went astray: but now have I kept thy
word.

119:68 thou art good, and doest good; teach me thi statutes.

119:69 the proud have forg a lie against me: but I will keep thy
precept with my whole heart.

119:70 their heart is as fat as grease; but I delight in thi law.

119:71 It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might
learn thi statutes.

119:72 the law of thi mouth is better unto me than thousand of gold
and silver.

119:73 thi hand have made me and fashion me: give me understanding,
that I may learn thi commandments.

119:74 they that fear thee will be glad when they see me; becaus i
hav hope in thi word.

119:75 I know, O lord, that thi judgment are right, and that thou in
faith hast afflict me.

119:76 let, I pray thee, thi merci kind be for my comfort,
accord to thi word unto thi servant.

119:77 let thi tender merci come unto me, that I may live: for thy
law is my delight.

119:78 let the proud be ashamed; for they dealt pervers with me
without a cause: but I will medit in thi precepts.

119:79 let those that fear thee turn unto me, and those that have
known thi testimonies.

119:80 let my heart be sound in thi statutes; that I be not ashamed.

119:81 My soul fainteth for thi salvation: but I hope in thi word.

119:82 mine eye fail for thi word, saying, when wilt thou comfort me?

119:83 for I am becom like a bottl in the smoke; yet do I not forget
thi statutes.

119:84 how mani are the day of thi servant? when wilt thou execute
judg on them that persecut me?

119:85 the proud have dig pit for me, which are not after thi law.

119:86 all thi command are faithful: they persecut me
wrongfully; help thou me.

119:87 they had almost consum me upon earth; but I forsook not thy
precepts.

119:88 quicken me after thi lovingkindness; so shall I keep the
testimoni of thi mouth.

119:89 for ever, O lord, thi word is settl in heaven.

119:90 thi faith is unto all generations: thou hast established
th earth, and it abideth.

119:91 they continu thi day accord to thine ordinances: for all
ar thi servants.

119:92 unless thi law had been my delights, I should then have
perish in mine affliction.

119:93 I will never forget thi precepts: for with them thou hast
quicken me.

119:94 I am thine, save me: for I have sought thi precepts.

119:95 the wick have wait for me to destroy me: but I will
consid thi testimonies.

119:96 I have seen an end of all perfection: but thi command is
exceed broad.

119:97 O how I love thi law! it is my medit all the day.

119:98 thou through thi command hast made me wiser than mine
enemies: for they are ever with me.

119:99 I have more understand than all my teachers: for thy
testimoni are my meditation.

119:100 I understand more than the ancients, becaus I keep thy
precepts.

119:101 I have refrain my feet from everi evil way, that I might
keep thi word.

119:102 I have not depart from thi judgments: for thou hast taught
me.

119:103 how sweet are thi word unto my taste! yea, sweeter than honey
to my mouth!

119:104 through thi precept I get understanding: therefor I hate
everi fals way.

119:105 thi word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.

119:106 I have sworn, and I will perform it, that I will keep thy
right judgments.

119:107 I am afflict veri much: quicken me, O lord, accord unto
thi word.

119:108 accept, I beseech thee, the freewil offer of my mouth, o
lord, and teach me thi judgments.

119:109 My soul is continu in my hand: yet do I not forget thy
law.

119:110 the wick have laid a snare for me: yet I er not from thy
precepts.

119:111 thi testimoni have I taken as an heritag for ever: for they
ar the rejoic of my heart.

119:112 I have inclin mine heart to perform thi statut alway, even
unto the end.

119:113 I hate vain thoughts: but thi law do I love.

119:114 thou art my hide place and my shield: I hope in thi word.

119:115 depart from me, ye evildoers: for I will keep the commandments
of my god.

119:116 uphold me accord unto thi word, that I may live: and let me
not be asham of my hope.

119:117 hold thou me up, and I shall be safe: and I will have respect
unto thi statut continually.

119:118 thou hast trodden down all them that err from thi statutes:
for their deceit is falsehood.

119:119 thou puttest away all the wick of the earth like dross:
therefor I love thi testimonies.

119:120 My flesh trembleth for fear of thee; and I am afraid of thy
judgments.

119:121 I have done judgment and justice: leav me not to mine
oppressors.

119:122 Be sureti for thi servant for good: let not the proud oppress
me.

119:123 mine eye fail for thi salvation, and for the word of thy
righteousness.

119:124 deal with thi servant accord unto thi mercy, and teach me
thi statutes.

119:125 I am thi servant; give me understanding, that I may know thy
testimonies.

119:126 It is time for thee, lord, to work: for they have made void
thi law.

119:127 therefor I love thi command abov gold; yea, abov fine
gold.

119:128 therefor I esteem all thi precept concern all thing to
b right; and I hate everi fals way.

119:129 thi testimoni are wonderful: therefor doth my soul keep
them.

119:130 the entranc of thi word giveth light; it giveth
understand unto the simple.

119:131 I open my mouth, and panted: for I long for thy
commandments.

119:132 look thou upon me, and be merci unto me, as thou usest to
do unto those that love thi name.

119:133 order my step in thi word: and let not ani iniqu have
dominion over me.

119:134 deliv me from the oppress of man: so will I keep thy
precepts.

119:135 make thi face to shine upon thi servant; and teach me thy
statutes.

119:136 river of water run down mine eyes, becaus they keep not thy
law.

119:137 righteou art thou, O lord, and upright are thi judgments.

119:138 thi testimoni that thou hast command are righteou and
veri faithful.

119:139 My zeal hath consum me, becaus mine enemi have forgotten
thi words.

119:140 thi word is veri pure: therefor thi servant loveth it.

119:141 I am small and despised: yet do not I forget thi precepts.

119:142 thi righteous is an everlast righteousness, and thi law
i the truth.

119:143 troubl and anguish have taken hold on me: yet thy
command are my delights.

119:144 the righteous of thi testimoni is everlasting: give me
understanding, and I shall live.

119:145 I cri with my whole heart; hear me, O lord: I will keep thy
statutes.

119:146 I cri unto thee; save me, and I shall keep thi testimonies.

119:147 I prevent the dawn of the morning, and cried: I hope in
thi word.

119:148 mine eye prevent the night watches, that I might medit in
thi word.

119:149 hear my voic accord unto thi lovingkindness: O lord,
quicken me accord to thi judgment.

119:150 they draw nigh that follow after mischief: they are far from
thi law.

119:151 thou art near, O lord; and all thi command are truth.

119:152 concern thi testimonies, I have known of old that thou hast
found them for ever.

119:153 consid mine affliction, and deliv me: for I do not forget
thi law.

119:154 plead my cause, and deliv me: quicken me accord to thy
word.

119:155 salvat is far from the wicked: for they seek not thy
statutes.

119:156 great are thi tender mercies, O lord: quicken me accord to
thi judgments.

119:157 mani are my persecutor and mine enemies; yet do I not decline
from thi testimonies.

119:158 I beheld the transgressors, and wa grieved; becaus they kept
not thi word.

119:159 consid how I love thi precepts: quicken me, O lord,
accord to thi lovingkindness.

119:160 thi word is true from the beginning: and everi one of thy
right judgment endureth for ever.

119:161 princ have persecut me without a cause: but my heart
standeth in awe of thi word.

119:162 I rejoic at thi word, as one that findeth great spoil.

119:163 I hate and abhor lying: but thi law do I love.

119:164 seven time a day do I prais thee becaus of thi righteous
judgments.

119:165 great peac have they which love thi law: and noth shall
offend them.

119:166 lord, I have hope for thi salvation, and done thy
commandments.

119:167 My soul hath kept thi testimonies; and I love them
exceedingly.

119:168 I have kept thi precept and thi testimonies: for all my ways
ar befor thee.

119:169 let my cri come near befor thee, O lord: give me
understand accord to thi word.

119:170 let my supplic come befor thee: deliv me accord to
thi word.

119:171 My lip shall utter praise, when thou hast taught me thy
statutes.

119:172 My tongu shall speak of thi word: for all thi commandments
ar righteousness.

119:173 let thine hand help me; for I have chosen thi precepts.

119:174 I have long for thi salvation, O lord; and thi law is my
delight.

119:175 let my soul live, and it shall prais thee; and let thy
judg help me.

119:176 I have gone astray like a lost sheep; seek thi servant; for i
do not forget thi commandments.



120:1 In my distress I cri unto the lord, and he heard me.

120:2 deliv my soul, O lord, from lie lips, and from a deceitful
tongue.

120:3 what shall be given unto thee? or what shall be done unto thee,
thou fals tongue?

120:4 sharp arrow of the mighty, with coal of juniper.

120:5 woe is me, that I sojourn in mesech, that I dwell in the tents
of kedar!

120:6 My soul hath long dwelt with him that hateth peace.

120:7 I am for peace: but when I speak, they are for war.



121:1 I will lift up mine eye unto the hills, from whenc cometh my
help.

121:2 My help cometh from the lord, which made heaven and earth.

121:3 He will not suffer thi foot to be moved: he that keepeth thee
wil not slumber.

121:4 behold, he that keepeth israel shall neither slumber nor sleep.

121:5 the lord is thi keeper: the lord is thi shade upon thi right
hand.

121:6 the sun shall not smite thee by day, nor the moon by night.

121:7 the lord shall preserv thee from all evil: he shall preserve
thi soul.

121:8 the lord shall preserv thi go out and thi come in from
thi time forth, and even for evermore.



122:1 I wa glad when they said unto me, let us go into the hous of
th lord.

122:2 our feet shall stand within thi gates, O jerusalem.

122:3 jerusalem is build as a citi that is compact together:

122:4 whither the tribe go up, the tribe of the lord, unto the
testimoni of israel, to give thank unto the name of the lord.

122:5 for there are set throne of judgment, the throne of the house
of david.

122:6 pray for the peac of jerusalem: they shall prosper that love
thee.

122:7 peac be within thi walls, and prosper within thi palaces.

122:8 for my brethren and companions' sakes, I will now say, peac be
within thee.

122:9 becaus of the hous of the lord our god I will seek thi good.



123:1 unto thee lift I up mine eyes, O thou that dwellest in the
heavens.

123:2 behold, as the eye of servant look unto the hand of their
masters, and as the eye of a maiden unto the hand of her mistress; so
our eye wait upon the lord our god, until that he have merci upon us.

123:3 have merci upon us, O lord, have merci upon us: for we are
exceedingli fill with contempt.

123:4 our soul is exceedingli fill with the scorn of those that
ar at ease, and with the contempt of the proud.



124:1 If it had not been the lord who wa on our side, now may israel
say;

124:2 If it had not been the lord who wa on our side, when men rose
up against us:

124:3 then they had swallow us up quick, when their wrath was
kindl against us:

124:4 then the water had overwhelm us, the stream had gone over our
soul:

124:5 then the proud water had gone over our soul.

124:6 bless be the lord, who hath not given us as a prey to their
teeth.

124:7 our soul is escap as a bird out of the snare of the fowlers:
th snare is broken, and we are escaped.

124:8 our help is in the name of the lord, who made heaven and earth.



125:1 they that trust in the lord shall be as mount zion, which cannot
b removed, but abideth for ever.

125:2 As the mountain are round about jerusalem, so the lord is round
about hi peopl from henceforth even for ever.

125:3 for the rod of the wick shall not rest upon the lot of the
righteous; lest the righteou put forth their hand unto iniquity.

125:4 Do good, O lord, unto those that be good, and to them that are
upright in their hearts.

125:5 As for such as turn asid unto their crook ways, the lord
shal lead them forth with the worker of iniquity: but peac shall be
upon israel.



126:1 when the lord turn again the captiv of zion, we were like
them that dream.

126:2 then wa our mouth fill with laughter, and our tongu with
singing: then said they among the heathen, the lord hath done great
th for them.

126:3 the lord hath done great thing for us; whereof we are glad.

126:4 turn again our captivity, O lord, as the stream in the south.

126:5 they that sow in tear shall reap in joy.

126:6 He that goeth forth and weepeth, bear preciou seed, shall
doubtless come again with rejoicing, bring hi sheav with him.



127:1 except the lord build the house, they labour in vain that build
it: except the lord keep the city, the watchman waketh but in vain.

127:2 It is vain for you to rise up early, to sit up late, to eat the
bread of sorrows: for so he giveth hi belov sleep.

127:3 lo, children are an heritag of the lord: and the fruit of the
womb is hi reward.

127:4 As arrow are in the hand of a mighti man; so are children of
th youth.

127:5 happi is the man that hath hi quiver full of them: they shall
not be ashamed, but they shall speak with the enemi in the gate.



128:1 bless is everi one that feareth the lord; that walketh in his
ways.

128:2 for thou shalt eat the labour of thine hands: happi shalt thou
be, and it shall be well with thee.

128:3 thi wife shall be as a fruit vine by the side of thine
house: thi children like oliv plant round about thi table.

128:4 behold, that thu shall the man be bless that feareth the
lord.

128:5 the lord shall bless thee out of zion: and thou shalt see the
good of jerusalem all the day of thi life.

128:6 yea, thou shalt see thi children' children, and peac upon
israel.



129:1 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth, may israel now
say:

129:2 mani a time have they afflict me from my youth: yet they have
not prevail against me.

129:3 the plower plow upon my back: they made long their furrows.

129:4 the lord is righteous: he hath cut asund the cord of the
wicked.

129:5 let them all be confound and turn back that hate zion.

129:6 let them be as the grass upon the housetops, which withereth
afor it groweth up:

129:7 wherewith the mower filleth not hi hand; nor he that bindeth
sheav hi bosom.

129:8 neither do they which go by say, the bless of the lord be
upon you: we bless you in the name of the lord.



130:1 out of the depth have I cri unto thee, O lord.

130:2 lord, hear my voice: let thine ear be attent to the voic of
mi supplications.

130:3 If thou, lord, shouldest mark iniquities, O lord, who shall
stand?

130:4 but there is forgiv with thee, that thou mayest be feared.

130:5 I wait for the lord, my soul doth wait, and in hi word do i
hope.

130:6 My soul waiteth for the lord more than they that watch for the
morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.

130:7 let israel hope in the lord: for with the lord there is mercy,
and with him is plenteou redemption.

130:8 and he shall redeem israel from all hi iniquities.



131:1 lord, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eye lofty: neither do i
exercis myself in great matters, or in thing too high for me.

131:2 sure I have behav and quiet myself, as a child that is
wean of hi mother: my soul is even as a wean child.

131:3 let israel hope in the lord from henceforth and for ever.



132:1 lord, rememb david, and all hi afflictions:

132:2 how he sware unto the lord, and vow unto the mighti god of
jacob;

132:3 sure I will not come into the tabernacl of my house, nor go
up into my bed;

132:4 I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,

132:5 until I find out a place for the lord, an habit for the
mighti god of jacob.

132:6 lo, we heard of it at ephratah: we found it in the field of the
wood.

132:7 We will go into hi tabernacles: we will worship at his
footstool.

132:8 arise, O lord, into thi rest; thou, and the ark of thi strength.

132:9 let thi priest be cloth with righteousness; and let thy
saint shout for joy.

132:10 for thi servant david' sake turn not away the face of thine
anointed.

132:11 the lord hath sworn in truth unto david; he will not turn from
it; Of the fruit of thi bodi will I set upon thi throne.

132:12 If thi children will keep my coven and my testimoni that i
shal teach them, their children shall also sit upon thi throne for
evermore.

132:13 for the lord hath chosen zion; he hath desir it for his
habitation.

132:14 thi is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired
it.

132:15 I will abundantli bless her provision: I will satisfi her poor
with bread.

132:16 I will also cloth her priest with salvation: and her saints
shal shout aloud for joy.

132:17 there will I make the horn of david to bud: I have ordain a
lamp for mine anointed.

132:18 hi enemi will I cloth with shame: but upon himself shall
hi crown flourish.



133:1 behold, how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell
togeth in unity!

133:2 It is like the preciou ointment upon the head, that ran down
upon the beard, even aaron' beard: that went down to the skirt of
hi garments;

133:3 As the dew of hermon, and as the dew that descend upon the
mountain of zion: for there the lord command the blessing, even
lif for evermore.



134:1 behold, bless ye the lord, all ye servant of the lord, which by
night stand in the hous of the lord.

134:2 lift up your hand in the sanctuary, and bless the lord.

134:3 the lord that made heaven and earth bless thee out of zion.



135:1 prais ye the lord. prais ye the name of the lord; prais him,
o ye servant of the lord.

135:2 Ye that stand in the hous of the lord, in the court of the
hous of our god.

135:3 prais the lord; for the lord is good: sing prais unto his
name; for it is pleasant.

135:4 for the lord hath chosen jacob unto himself, and israel for his
peculiar treasure.

135:5 for I know that the lord is great, and that our lord is above
al gods.

135:6 whatsoev the lord pleased, that did he in heaven, and in
earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

135:7 He causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the earth; he
maketh lightn for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his
treasuries.

135:8 who smote the firstborn of egypt, both of man and beast.

135:9 who sent token and wonder into the midst of thee, O egypt,
upon pharaoh, and upon all hi servants.

135:10 who smote great nations, and slew mighti kings;

135:11 sihon king of the amorites, and Og king of bashan, and all the
kingdom of canaan:

135:12 and gave their land for an heritage, an heritag unto israel
hi people.

135:13 thi name, O lord, endureth for ever; and thi memorial, O lord,
throughout all generations.

135:14 for the lord will judg hi people, and he will repent himself
concern hi servants.

135:15 the idol of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men's
hands.

135:16 they have mouths, but they speak not; eye have they, but they
se not;

135:17 they have ears, but they hear not; neither is there ani breath
in their mouths.

135:18 they that make them are like unto them: so is everi one that
trusteth in them.

135:19 bless the lord, O hous of israel: bless the lord, O hous of
aaron:

135:20 bless the lord, O hous of levi: ye that fear the lord, bless
th lord.

135:21 bless be the lord out of zion, which dwelleth at jerusalem.

prais ye the lord.



136:1 O give thank unto the lord; for he is good: for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

136:2 O give thank unto the god of gods: for hi merci endureth for
ever.

136:3 O give thank to the lord of lords: for hi merci endureth for
ever.

136:4 To him who alon doeth great wonders: for hi merci endureth for
ever.

136:5 To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for hi merci endureth
for ever.

136:6 To him that stretch out the earth abov the waters: for his
merci endureth for ever.

136:7 To him that made great lights: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:8 the sun to rule by day: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:9 the moon and star to rule by night: for hi merci endureth for
ever.

136:10 To him that smote egypt in their firstborn: for hi mercy
endureth for ever:

136:11 and brought out israel from among them: for hi merci endureth
for ever:

136:12 with a strong hand, and with a stretch out arm: for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

136:13 To him which divid the red sea into parts: for hi mercy
endureth for ever:

136:14 and made israel to pass through the midst of it: for hi mercy
endureth for ever:

136:15 but overthrew pharaoh and hi host in the red sea: for his
merci endureth for ever.

136:16 To him which led hi peopl through the wilderness: for his
merci endureth for ever.

136:17 To him which smote great kings: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:18 and slew famou kings: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:19 sihon king of the amorites: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:20 and Og the king of bashan: for hi merci endureth for ever:

136:21 and gave their land for an heritage: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:22 even an heritag unto israel hi servant: for hi mercy
endureth for ever.

136:23 who rememb us in our low estate: for hi merci endureth for
ever:

136:24 and hath redeem us from our enemies: for hi merci endureth
for ever.

136:25 who giveth food to all flesh: for hi merci endureth for ever.

136:26 O give thank unto the god of heaven: for hi merci endureth
for ever.



137:1 By the river of babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when
w rememb zion.

137:2 We hang our harp upon the willow in the midst thereof.

137:3 for there they that carri us away captiv requir of us a
song; and they that wast us requir of us mirth, saying, sing us
on of the song of zion.

137:4 how shall we sing the lord' song in a strang land?

137:5 If I forget thee, O jerusalem, let my right hand forget her
cunning.

137:6 If I do not rememb thee, let my tongu cleav to the roof of
mi mouth; if I prefer not jerusalem abov my chief joy.

137:7 remember, O lord, the children of edom in the day of jerusalem;
who said, rase it, rase it, even to the foundat thereof.

137:8 O daughter of babylon, who art to be destroyed; happi shall he
be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast serv us.

137:9 happi shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thi littl ones
against the stones.



138:1 I will prais thee with my whole heart: befor the god will i
s prais unto thee.

138:2 I will worship toward thi holi temple, and prais thi name for
thi lovingkind and for thi truth: for thou hast magnifi thi word
abov all thi name.

138:3 In the day when I cri thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst
m with strength in my soul.

138:4 all the king of the earth shall prais thee, O lord, when they
hear the word of thi mouth.

138:5 yea, they shall sing in the way of the lord: for great is the
glori of the lord.

138:6 though the lord be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but
th proud he knoweth afar off.

138:7 though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt reviv me: thou
shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and
thi right hand shall save me.

138:8 the lord will perfect that which concerneth me: thi mercy, o
lord, endureth for ever: forsak not the work of thine own hands.



139:1 O lord, thou hast search me, and known me.

139:2 thou knowest my downsit and mine uprising, thou
understandest my thought afar off.

139:3 thou compassest my path and my lie down, and art acquainted
with all my ways.

139:4 for there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O lord, thou
knowest it altogether.

139:5 thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon
me.

139:6 such knowledg is too wonder for me; it is high, I cannot
attain unto it.

139:7 whither shall I go from thi spirit? or whither shall I flee from
thi presence?

139:8 If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in
hell, behold, thou art there.

139:9 If I take the wing of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost
part of the sea;

139:10 even there shall thi hand lead me, and thi right hand shall
hold me.

139:11 If I say, sure the dark shall cover me; even the night
shal be light about me.

139:12 yea, the dark hideth not from thee; but the night shineth
a the day: the dark and the light are both alik to thee.

139:13 for thou hast possess my reins: thou hast cover me in my
mother' womb.

139:14 I will prais thee; for I am fear and wonder made:
marvel are thi works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

139:15 My substanc wa not hid from thee, when I wa made in secret,
and curious wrought in the lowest part of the earth.

139:16 thine eye did see my substance, yet be unperfect; and in
thi book all my member were written, which in continu were
fashioned, when as yet there wa none of them.

139:17 how preciou also are thi thought unto me, O god! how great is
th sum of them!

139:18 If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand:
when I awake, I am still with thee.

139:19 sure thou wilt slay the wicked, O god: depart from me
therefore, ye bloodi men.

139:20 for they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemi take
thi name in vain.

139:21 Do not I hate them, O lord, that hate thee? and am not i
griev with those that rise up against thee?

139:22 I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

139:23 search me, O god, and know my heart: tri me, and know my
thoughts:

139:24 and see if there be ani wick way in me, and lead me in the
way everlasting.



140:1 deliv me, O lord, from the evil man: preserv me from the
viol man;

140:2 which imagin mischief in their heart; continu are they
gath togeth for war.

140:3 they have sharpen their tongu like a serpent; adders' poison
i under their lips. selah.

140:4 keep me, O lord, from the hand of the wicked; preserv me from
th violent man; who have purpos to overthrow my goings.

140:5 the proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a
net by the wayside; they have set gin for me. selah.

140:6 I said unto the lord, thou art my god: hear the voic of my
supplications, O lord.

140:7 O god the lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered
mi head in the day of battle.

140:8 grant not, O lord, the desir of the wicked: further not his
wick device; lest they exalt themselves. selah.

140:9 As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief
of their own lip cover them.

140:10 let burn coal fall upon them: let them be cast into the
fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

140:11 let not an evil speaker be establish in the earth: evil shall
hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

140:12 I know that the lord will maintain the caus of the afflicted,
and the right of the poor.

140:13 sure the righteou shall give thank unto thi name: the
upright shall dwell in thi presence.



141:1 lord, I cri unto thee: make hast unto me; give ear unto my
voice, when I cri unto thee.

141:2 let my prayer be set forth befor thee as incense; and the
lift up of my hand as the even sacrifice.

141:3 set a watch, O lord, befor my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

141:4 inclin not my heart to ani evil thing, to practis wick works
with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

141:5 let the righteou smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him
reprov me; it shall be an excel oil, which shall not break my
head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

141:6 when their judg are overthrown in stoni places, they shall
hear my words; for they are sweet.

141:7 our bone are scatter at the grave' mouth, as when one
cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

141:8 but mine eye are unto thee, O god the lord: in thee is my
trust; leav not my soul destitute.

141:9 keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, and the
gin of the worker of iniquity.

141:10 let the wick fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal
escape.



142:1 I cri unto the lord with my voice; with my voic unto the lord
did I make my supplication.

142:2 I pour out my complaint befor him; I shew befor him my
trouble.

142:3 when my spirit wa overwhelm within me, then thou knewest my
path.

in the way wherein I walk have they privili laid a snare for me.

142:4 I look on my right hand, and beheld, but there wa no man that
would know me: refug fail me; no man care for my soul.

142:5 I cri unto thee, O lord: I said, thou art my refug and my
port in the land of the living.

142:6 attend unto my cry; for I am brought veri low: deliv me from
mi persecutors; for they are stronger than i.

142:7 bring my soul out of prison, that I may prais thi name: the
right shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bounti with
me.



143:1 hear my prayer, O lord, give ear to my supplications: in thy
faith answer me, and in thi righteousness.

143:2 and enter not into judgment with thi servant: for in thi sight
shal no man live be justified.

143:3 for the enemi hath persecut my soul; he hath smitten my life
down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those
that have been long dead.

143:4 therefor is my spirit overwhelm within me; my heart within me
i desolate.

143:5 I rememb the day of old; I medit on all thi works; I muse
on the work of thi hands.

143:6 I stretch forth my hand unto thee: my soul thirsteth after
thee, as a thirsti land. selah.

143:7 hear me speedily, O lord: my spirit faileth: hide not thi face
from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

143:8 caus me to hear thi lovingkind in the morning; for in thee
do I trust: caus me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift
up my soul unto thee.

143:9 deliv me, O lord, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide
me.

143:10 teach me to do thi will; for thou art my god: thi spirit is
good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

143:11 quicken me, O lord, for thi name' sake: for thi righteousness'
sak bring my soul out of trouble.

143:12 and of thi merci cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them
that afflict my soul: for I am thi servant.



144:1 bless be the lord my strength which teacheth my hand to war,
and my finger to fight:

144:2 My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer;
mi shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my peopl under me.

144:3 lord, what is man, that thou takest knowledg of him! or the son
of man, that thou makest account of him!

144:4 man is like to vanity: hi day are as a shadow that passeth
away.

144:5 bow thi heavens, O lord, and come down: touch the mountains, and
they shall smoke.

144:6 cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows,
and destroy them.

144:7 send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliv me out of great
waters, from the hand of strang children;

144:8 whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right
hand of falsehood.

144:9 I will sing a new song unto thee, O god: upon a psalteri and an
instru of ten string will I sing prais unto thee.

144:10 It is he that giveth salvat unto kings: who delivereth david
hi servant from the hurt sword.

144:11 rid me, and deliv me from the hand of strang children, whose
mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of
falsehood:

144:12 that our son may be as plant grown up in their youth; that
our daughter may be as corner stones, polish after the similitude
of a palace:

144:13 that our garner may be full, afford all manner of store:
that our sheep may bring forth thousand and ten thousand in our
streets:

144:14 that our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no
break in, nor go out; that there be no complain in our
streets.

144:15 happi is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happi is
that people, whose god is the lord.



145:1 I will extol thee, my god, O king; and I will bless thi name for
ev and ever.

145:2 everi day will I bless thee; and I will prais thi name for ever
and ever.

145:3 great is the lord, and greatli to be praised; and hi greatness
i unsearchable.

145:4 one gener shall prais thi work to another, and shall
declar thi mighti acts.

145:5 I will speak of the gloriou honour of thi majesty, and of thy
wondr works.

145:6 and men shall speak of the might of thi terribl acts: and i
wil declar thi greatness.

145:7 they shall abundantli utter the memori of thi great goodness,
and shall sing of thi righteousness.

145:8 the lord is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and
of great mercy.

145:9 the lord is good to all: and hi tender merci are over all his
works.

145:10 all thi work shall prais thee, O lord; and thi saint shall
bless thee.

145:11 they shall speak of the glori of thi kingdom, and talk of thy
power;

145:12 To make known to the son of men hi mighti acts, and the
glori majesti of hi kingdom.

145:13 thi kingdom is an everlast kingdom, and thi dominion
endureth throughout all generations.

145:14 the lord upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that
b bow down.

145:15 the eye of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat
in due season.

145:16 thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desir of every
liv thing.

145:17 the lord is righteou in all hi ways, and holi in all his
works.

145:18 the lord is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that
cal upon him in truth.

145:19 He will fulfil the desir of them that fear him: he also will
hear their cry, and will save them.

145:20 the lord preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked
wil he destroy.

145:21 My mouth shall speak the prais of the lord: and let all flesh
bless hi holi name for ever and ever.



146:1 prais ye the lord. prais the lord, O my soul.

146:2 while I live will I prais the lord: I will sing prais unto my
god while I have ani being.

146:3 put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom
ther is no help.

146:4 hi breath goeth forth, he returneth to hi earth; in that very
day hi thought perish.

146:5 happi is he that hath the god of jacob for hi help, whose hope
i in the lord hi god:

146:6 which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is:
which keepeth truth for ever:

146:7 which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to
th hungry. the lord looseth the prisoners:

146:8 the lord openeth the eye of the blind: the lord raiseth them
that are bow down: the lord loveth the righteous:

146:9 the lord preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless
and widow: but the way of the wick he turneth upsid down.

146:10 the lord shall reign for ever, even thi god, O zion, unto all
generations. prais ye the lord.



147:1 prais ye the lord: for it is good to sing prais unto our god;
for it is pleasant; and prais is comely.

147:2 the lord doth build up jerusalem: he gathereth togeth the
outcast of israel.

147:3 He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

147:4 He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their
names.

147:5 great is our lord, and of great power: hi understand is
infinite.

147:6 the lord lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wick down to the
ground.

147:7 sing unto the lord with thanksgiving; sing prais upon the harp
unto our god:

147:8 who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the
earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

147:9 He giveth to the beast hi food, and to the young raven which
cry.

147:10 He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not
pleasur in the leg of a man.

147:11 the lord taketh pleasur in them that fear him, in those that
hop in hi mercy.

147:12 prais the lord, O jerusalem; prais thi god, O zion.

147:13 for he hath strengthen the bar of thi gates; he hath blessed
thi children within thee.

147:14 He maketh peac in thi borders, and filleth thee with the
finest of the wheat.

147:15 He sendeth forth hi command upon earth: hi word runneth
veri swiftly.

147:16 He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like
ashes.

147:17 He casteth forth hi ice like morsels: who can stand befor his
cold?

147:18 He sendeth out hi word, and melteth them: he causeth hi wind
to blow, and the water flow.

147:19 He sheweth hi word unto jacob, hi statut and hi judgments
unto israel.

147:20 He hath not dealt so with ani nation: and as for hi judgments,
they have not known them. prais ye the lord.



148:1 prais ye the lord. prais ye the lord from the heavens: praise
him in the heights.

148:2 prais ye him, all hi angels: prais ye him, all hi hosts.

148:3 prais ye him, sun and moon: prais him, all ye star of light.

148:4 prais him, ye heaven of heavens, and ye water that be above
th heavens.

148:5 let them prais the name of the lord: for he commanded, and they
wer created.

148:6 He hath also stablish them for ever and ever: he hath made a
decre which shall not pass.

148:7 prais the lord from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

148:8 fire, and hail; snow, and vapours; stormi wind fulfil his
word:

148:9 mountains, and all hills; fruit trees, and all cedars:

148:10 beasts, and all cattle; creep things, and fli fowl:

148:11 king of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judg of
th earth:

148:12 both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

148:13 let them prais the name of the lord: for hi name alon is
excellent; hi glori is abov the earth and heaven.

148:14 He also exalteth the horn of hi people, the prais of all his
saints; even of the children of israel, a peopl near unto him. praise
y the lord.



149:1 prais ye the lord. sing unto the lord a new song, and his
prais in the congreg of saints.

149:2 let israel rejoic in him that made him: let the children of
zion be joy in their king.

149:3 let them prais hi name in the dance: let them sing praises
unto him with the timbrel and harp.

149:4 for the lord taketh pleasur in hi people: he will beautifi the
meek with salvation.

149:5 let the saint be joy in glory: let them sing aloud upon
their beds.

149:6 let the high prais of god be in their mouth, and a two-edged
sword in their hand;

149:7 To execut vengeanc upon the heathen, and punish upon the
people;

149:8 To bind their king with chains, and their nobl with fetters
of iron;

149:9 To execut upon them the judgment written: thi honour have all
hi saints. prais ye the lord.



150:1 prais ye the lord. prais god in hi sanctuary: prais him in
th firmament of hi power.

150:2 prais him for hi mighti acts: prais him accord to his
excel greatness.

150:3 prais him with the sound of the trumpet: prais him with the
psalteri and harp.

150:4 prais him with the timbrel and dance: prais him with stringed
instru and organs.

150:5 prais him upon the loud cymbals: prais him upon the high
sound cymbals.

150:6 let everi thing that hath breath prais the lord. prais ye the lord.




th proverbs


1:1 the proverb of solomon the son of david, king of israel; 1:2 to
know wisdom and instruction; to perceiv the word of understanding;
1:3 To receiv the instruct of wisdom, justice, and judgment, and
equity; 1:4 To give subtilti to the simple, to the young man knowledge
and discretion.

1:5 A wise man will hear, and will increas learning; and a man of
understand shall attain unto wise counsels: 1:6 To understand a
proverb, and the interpretation; the word of the wise, and their dark
sayings.

1:7 the fear of the lord is the begin of knowledge: but fools
despis wisdom and instruction.

1:8 My son, hear the instruct of thi father, and forsak not the
law of thi mother: 1:9 for they shall be an ornament of grace unto thy
head, and chain about thi neck.

1:10 My son, if sinner entic thee, consent thou not.

1:11 If they say, come with us, let us lay wait for blood, let us lurk
privili for the innoc without cause: 1:12 let us swallow them up
al as the grave; and whole, as those that go down into the pit:
1:13 We shall find all preciou substance, we shall fill our houses
with spoil: 1:14 cast in thi lot among us; let us all have one purse:
1:15 My son, walk not thou in the way with them; refrain thi foot from
their path: 1:16 for their feet run to evil, and make hast to shed
blood.

1:17 sure in vain the net is spread in the sight of ani bird.

1:18 and they lay wait for their own blood; they lurk privili for
their own lives.

1:19 So are the way of everi one that is greedi of gain; which taketh
away the life of the owner thereof.

1:20 wisdom crieth without; she uttereth her voic in the streets:
1:21 she crieth in the chief place of concourse, in the open of
th gates: in the citi she uttereth her words, saying, 1:22 how long,
y simpl ones, will ye love simplicity? and the scorner delight in
their scorning, and fool hate knowledge?  1:23 turn you at my
reproof: behold, I will pour out my spirit unto you, I will make known
mi word unto you.

1:24 becaus I have called, and ye refused; I have stretch out my
hand, and no man regarded; 1:25 but ye have set at nought all my
counsel, and would none of my reproof: 1:26 I also will laugh at your
calamity; I will mock when your fear cometh; 1:27 when your fear
cometh as desolation, and your destruct cometh as a whirlwind; when
distress and anguish cometh upon you.

1:28 then shall they call upon me, but I will not answer; they shall
seek me early, but they shall not find me: 1:29 for that they hated
