knowledge, and did not choos the fear of the lord: 1:30 they would
non of my counsel: they despis all my reproof.

1:31 therefor shall they eat of the fruit of their own way, and be
fil with their own devices.

1:32 for the turn away of the simpl shall slay them, and the
prosper of fool shall destroy them.

1:33 but whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be
quiet from fear of evil.

2:1 My son, if thou wilt receiv my words, and hide my commandments
with thee; 2:2 So that thou inclin thine ear unto wisdom, and apply
thin heart to understanding; 2:3 yea, if thou criest after knowledge,
and liftest up thi voic for understanding; 2:4 If thou seekest her as
silver, and searchest for her as for hid treasures; 2:5 then shalt
thou understand the fear of the lord, and find the knowledg of god.

2:6 for the lord giveth wisdom: out of hi mouth cometh knowledg and
understanding.

2:7 He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to
them that walk uprightly.

2:8 He keepeth the path of judgment, and preserveth the way of his
saints.

2:9 then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, and
equity; yea, everi good path.

2:10 when wisdom entereth into thine heart, and knowledg is pleasant
unto thi soul; 2:11 discret shall preserv thee, understanding
shal keep thee: 2:12 To deliv thee from the way of the evil man,
from the man that speaketh froward things; 2:13 who leav the path of
uprightness, to walk in the way of darkness; 2:14 who rejoic to do
evil, and delight in the froward of the wicked; 2:15 whose ways
ar crooked, and they froward in their paths: 2:16 To deliv thee
from the strang woman, even from the stranger which flattereth with
her words; 2:17 which forsaketh the guid of her youth, and forgetteth
th coven of her god.

2:18 for her hous inclineth unto death, and her path unto the dead.

2:19 none that go unto her return again, neither take they hold of the
path of life.

2:20 that thou mayest walk in the way of good men, and keep the paths
of the righteous.

2:21 for the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall
remain in it.

2:22 but the wick shall be cut off from the earth, and the
transgressor shall be root out of it.

3:1 My son, forget not my law; but let thine heart keep my
commandments: 3:2 for length of days, and long life, and peace, shall
they add to thee.

3:3 let not merci and truth forsak thee: bind them about thi neck;
writ them upon the tabl of thine heart: 3:4 So shalt thou find
favour and good understand in the sight of god and man.

3:5 trust in the lord with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine
own understanding.

3:6 In all thi way acknowledg him, and he shall direct thi paths.

3:7 Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the lord, and depart from
evil.

3:8 It shall be health to thi navel, and marrow to thi bones.

3:9 honour the lord with thi substance, and with the firstfruit of
al thine increase: 3:10 So shall thi barn be fill with plenty, and
thi press shall burst out with new wine.

3:11 My son, despis not the chasten of the lord; neither be weary
of hi correction: 3:12 for whom the lord loveth he correcteth; even
a a father the son in whom he delighteth.

3:13 happi is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth
understanding.

3:14 for the merchandis of it is better than the merchandis of
silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.

3:15 she is more preciou than rubies: and all the thing thou canst
desir are not to be compar unto her.

3:16 length of day is in her right hand; and in her left hand riches
and honour.

3:17 her way are way of pleasantness, and all her path are peace.

3:18 she is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy
i everi one that retaineth her.

3:19 the lord by wisdom hath found the earth; by understand hath
h establish the heavens.

3:20 By hi knowledg the depth are broken up, and the cloud drop
down the dew.

3:21 My son, let not them depart from thine eyes: keep sound wisdom
and discretion: 3:22 So shall they be life unto thi soul, and grace to
thi neck.

3:23 then shalt thou walk in thi way safely, and thi foot shall not
stumble.

3:24 when thou liest down, thou shalt not be afraid: yea, thou shalt
li down, and thi sleep shall be sweet.

3:25 Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desol of the
wicked, when it cometh.

3:26 for the lord shall be thi confidence, and shall keep thi foot
from be taken.

3:27 withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the
pow of thine hand to do it.

3:28 say not unto thi neighbour, go, and come again, and to morrow i
wil give; when thou hast it by thee.

3:29 devis not evil against thi neighbour, see he dwelleth
secur by thee.

3:30 strive not with a man without cause, if he have done thee no
harm.

3:31 envi thou not the oppressor, and choos none of hi ways.

3:32 for the froward is abomin to the lord: but hi secret is
with the righteous.

3:33 the curs of the lord is in the hous of the wicked: but he
blesseth the habit of the just.

3:34 sure he scorneth the scorners: but he giveth grace unto the
lowly.

3:35 the wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promot of
fools.

4:1 hear, ye children, the instruct of a father, and attend to know
understanding.

4:2 for I give you good doctrine, forsak ye not my law.

4:3 for I wa my father' son, tender and onli belov in the sight of
mi mother.

4:4 He taught me also, and said unto me, let thine heart retain my
words: keep my commandments, and live.

4:5 get wisdom, get understanding: forget it not; neither declin from
th word of my mouth.

4:6 forsak her not, and she shall preserv thee: love her, and she
shal keep thee.

4:7 wisdom is the princip thing; therefor get wisdom: and with all
thi get get understanding.

4:8 exalt her, and she shall promot thee: she shall bring thee to
honour, when thou dost embrac her.

4:9 she shall give to thine head an ornament of grace: a crown of
glori shall she deliv to thee.

4:10 hear, O my son, and receiv my sayings; and the year of thi life
shal be many.

4:11 I have taught thee in the way of wisdom; I have led thee in right
paths.

4:12 when thou goest, thi step shall not be straitened; and when thou
runnest, thou shalt not stumble.

4:13 take fast hold of instruction; let her not go: keep her; for she
i thi life.

4:14 enter not into the path of the wicked, and go not in the way of
evil men.

4:15 avoid it, pass not by it, turn from it, and pass away.

4:16 for they sleep not, except they have done mischief; and their
sleep is taken away, unless they caus some to fall.

4:17 for they eat the bread of wickedness, and drink the wine of
violence.

4:18 but the path of the just is as the shine light, that shineth
mor and more unto the perfect day.

4:19 the way of the wick is as darkness: they know not at what they
stumble.

4:20 My son, attend to my words; inclin thine ear unto my sayings.

4:21 let them not depart from thine eyes; keep them in the midst of
thin heart.

4:22 for they are life unto those that find them, and health to all
their flesh.

4:23 keep thi heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues
of life.

4:24 put away from thee a froward mouth, and pervers lip put far
from thee.

4:25 let thine eye look right on, and let thine eyelid look straight
befor thee.

4:26 ponder the path of thi feet, and let all thi way be established.

4:27 turn not to the right hand nor to the left: remov thi foot from
evil.

5:1 My son, attend unto my wisdom, and bow thine ear to my
understanding: 5:2 that thou mayest regard discretion, and that thy
lip may keep knowledge.

5:3 for the lip of a strang woman drop as an honeycomb, and her
mouth is smoother than oil: 5:4 but her end is bitter as wormwood,
sharp as a two-edg sword.

5:5 her feet go down to death; her step take hold on hell.

5:6 lest thou shouldest ponder the path of life, her way are
moveable, that thou canst not know them.

5:7 hear me now therefore, O ye children, and depart not from the
word of my mouth.

5:8 remov thi way far from her, and come not nigh the door of her
house: 5:9 lest thou give thine honour unto others, and thi year unto
th cruel: 5:10 lest stranger be fill with thi wealth; and thy
labour be in the hous of a stranger; 5:11 and thou mourn at the
last, when thi flesh and thi bodi are consumed, 5:12 and say, how have
i hate instruction, and my heart despis reproof; 5:13 and have not
obey the voic of my teachers, nor inclin mine ear to them that
instruct me!  5:14 I wa almost in all evil in the midst of the
congreg and assembly.

5:15 drink water out of thine own cistern, and run water out of
thin own well.

5:16 let thi fountain be dispers abroad, and river of water in
th streets.

5:17 let them be onli thine own, and not strangers' with thee.

5:18 let thi fountain be blessed: and rejoic with the wife of thy
youth.

5:19 let her be as the love hind and pleasant roe; let her breasts
satisfi thee at all times; and be thou ravish alway with her love.

5:20 and whi wilt thou, my son, be ravish with a strang woman, and
embrac the bosom of a stranger?  5:21 for the way of man are before
th eye of the lord, and he pondereth all hi goings.

5:22 hi own iniqu shall take the wick himself, and he shall be
holden with the cord of hi sins.

5:23 He shall die without instruction; and in the great of his
folli he shall go astray.

6:1 My son, if thou be sureti for thi friend, if thou hast stricken
thi hand with a stranger, 6:2 thou art snare with the word of thy
mouth, thou art taken with the word of thi mouth.

6:3 Do thi now, my son, and deliv thyself, when thou art come into
th hand of thi friend; go, humbl thyself, and make sure thi friend.

6:4 give not sleep to thine eyes, nor slumber to thine eyelids.

6:5 deliv thyself as a roe from the hand of the hunter, and as a
bird from the hand of the fowler.

6:6 Go to the ant, thou sluggard; consid her ways, and be wise: 6:7
which have no guide, overseer, or ruler, 6:8 provideth her meat in
th summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.

6:9 how long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou aris out of
thi sleep?  6:10 yet a littl sleep, a littl slumber, a little
fold of the hand to sleep: 6:11 So shall thi poverti come as one
that travelleth, and thi want as an arm man.

6:12 A naughti person, a wick man, walketh with a froward mouth.

6:13 He winketh with hi eyes, he speaketh with hi feet, he teacheth
with hi fingers; 6:14 froward is in hi heart, he deviseth
mischief continually; he soweth discord.

6:15 therefor shall hi calam come suddenly; suddenli shall he be
broken without remedy.

6:16 these six thing doth the lord hate: yea, seven are an
abomin unto him: 6:17 A proud look, a lie tongue, and hands
that shed innoc blood, 6:18 An heart that deviseth wicked
imaginations, feet that be swift in run to mischief, 6:19 A false
wit that speaketh lies, and he that soweth discord among brethren.

6:20 My son, keep thi father' commandment, and forsak not the law of
thi mother: 6:21 bind them continu upon thine heart, and tie them
about thi neck.

6:22 when thou goest, it shall lead thee; when thou sleepest, it shall
keep thee; and when thou awakest, it shall talk with thee.

6:23 for the command is a lamp; and the law is light; and reproofs
of instruct are the way of life: 6:24 To keep thee from the evil
woman, from the flatteri of the tongu of a strang woman.

6:25 lust not after her beauti in thine heart; neither let her take
the with her eyelids.

6:26 for by mean of a whorish woman a man is brought to a piec of
bread: and the adultress will hunt for the preciou life.

6:27 can a man take fire in hi bosom, and hi cloth not be burned?
6:28 can one go upon hot coals, and hi feet not be burned?  6:29 so
h that goeth in to hi neighbour' wife; whosoev toucheth her shall
not be innocent.

6:30 men do not despis a thief, if he steal to satisfi hi soul when
h is hungry; 6:31 but if he be found, he shall restor sevenfold; he
shal give all the substanc of hi house.

6:32 but whoso committeth adulteri with a woman lacketh understanding:
h that doeth it destroyeth hi own soul.

6:33 A wound and dishonour shall he get; and hi reproach shall not be
wip away.

6:34 for jealousi is the rage of a man: therefor he will not spare in
th day of vengeance.

6:35 He will not regard ani ransom; neither will he rest content,
though thou givest mani gifts.

7:1 My son, keep my words, and lay up my command with thee.

7:2 keep my commandments, and live; and my law as the appl of thine
eye.

7:3 bind them upon thi fingers, write them upon the tabl of thine
heart.

7:4 say unto wisdom, thou art my sister; and call understand thy
kinswoman: 7:5 that they may keep thee from the strang woman, from
th stranger which flattereth with her words.

7:6 for at the window of my hous I look through my casement, 7:7
and beheld among the simpl ones, I discern among the youths, a
young man void of understanding, 7:8 pass through the street near
her corner; and he went the way to her house, 7:9 In the twilight, in
th evening, in the black and dark night: 7:10 and, behold, there met
him a woman with the attir of an harlot, and subtil of heart.

7:11 (she is loud and stubborn; her feet abid not in her house: 7:12
now is she without, now in the streets, and lieth in wait at every
corner.)  7:13 So she caught him, and kiss him, and with an impudent
fac said unto him, 7:14 I have peac offer with me; thi day have
i pay my vows.

7:15 therefor came I forth to meet thee, dilig to seek thi face,
and I have found thee.

7:16 I have deck my bed with cover of tapestry, with carved
works, with fine linen of egypt.

7:17 I have perfum my bed with myrrh, aloes, and cinnamon.

7:18 come, let us take our fill of love until the morning: let us
solac ourselv with loves.

7:19 for the goodman is not at home, he is gone a long journey: 7:20
he hath taken a bag of money with him, and will come home at the day
appointed.

7:21 with her much fair speech she caus him to yield, with the
flatt of her lip she forc him.

7:22 He goeth after her straightway, as an ox goeth to the slaughter,
or as a fool to the correct of the stocks; 7:23 till a dart strike
through hi liver; as a bird hasteth to the snare, and knoweth not
that it is for hi life.

7:24 hearken unto me now therefore, O ye children, and attend to the
word of my mouth.

7:25 let not thine heart declin to her ways, go not astray in her
paths.

7:26 for she hath cast down mani wounded: yea, mani strong men have
been slain by her.

7:27 her hous is the way to hell, go down to the chamber of
death.

8:1 doth not wisdom cry? and understand put forth her voice?  8:2
she standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the place of
th paths.

8:3 she crieth at the gates, at the entri of the city, at the coming
in at the doors.

8:4 unto you, O men, I call; and my voic is to the son of man.

8:5 O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an
understand heart.

8:6 hear; for I will speak of excel things; and the open of my
lip shall be right things.

8:7 for my mouth shall speak truth; and wicked is an abomination
to my lips.

8:8 all the word of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing
froward or pervers in them.

8:9 they are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them
that find knowledge.

8:10 receiv my instruction, and not silver; and knowledg rather than
choic gold.

8:11 for wisdom is better than rubies; and all the thing that may be
desir are not to be compar to it.

8:12 I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledg of witty
inventions.

8:13 the fear of the lord is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and
th evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

8:14 counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have
strength.

8:15 By me king reign, and princ decre justice.

8:16 By me princ rule, and nobles, even all the judg of the earth.

8:17 I love them that love me; and those that seek me earli shall find
me.

8:18 rich and honour are with me; yea, durabl rich and
righteousness.

8:19 My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue
than choic silver.

8:20 I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the path of
judgment: 8:21 that I may caus those that love me to inherit
substance; and I will fill their treasures.

8:22 the lord possess me in the begin of hi way, befor his
work of old.

8:23 I wa set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the
earth was.

8:24 when there were no depths, I wa brought forth; when there were
no fountain abound with water.

8:25 befor the mountain were settled, befor the hill wa I brought
forth: 8:26 while as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields,
nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

8:27 when he prepar the heavens, I wa there: when he set a compass
upon the face of the depth: 8:28 when he establish the cloud above:
when he strengthen the fountain of the deep: 8:29 when he gave to
th sea hi decree, that the water should not pass hi commandment:
when he appoint the foundat of the earth: 8:30 then I wa by
him, as one brought up with him: and I wa daili hi delight,
rejo alway befor him; 8:31 rejoic in the habit part of
hi earth; and my delight were with the son of men.

8:32 now therefor hearken unto me, O ye children: for bless are
they that keep my ways.

8:33 hear instruction, and be wise, and refus it not.

8:34 bless is the man that heareth me, watch daili at my gates,
wait at the post of my doors.

8:35 for whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the
lord.

8:36 but he that sinneth against me wrongeth hi own soul: all they
that hate me love death.

9:1 wisdom hath build her house, she hath hewn out her seven
pillars: 9:2 she hath kill her beasts; she hath mingl her wine;
sh hath also furnish her table.

9:3 she hath sent forth her maidens: she crieth upon the highest
plac of the city, 9:4 whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: as
for him that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, 9:5 come, eat of
mi bread, and drink of the wine which I have mingled.

9:6 forsak the foolish, and live; and go in the way of understanding.

9:7 He that reproveth a scorner getteth to himself shame: and he that
rebuketh a wick man getteth himself a blot.

9:8 reprov not a scorner, lest he hate thee: rebuk a wise man, and
h will love thee.

9:9 give instruct to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser: teach a
just man, and he will increas in learning.

9:10 the fear of the lord is the begin of wisdom: and the
knowledg of the holi is understanding.

9:11 for by me thi day shall be multiplied, and the year of thi life
shal be increased.

9:12 If thou be wise, thou shalt be wise for thyself: but if thou
scornest, thou alon shalt bear it.

9:13 A foolish woman is clamorous: she is simple, and knoweth nothing.

9:14 for she sitteth at the door of her house, on a seat in the high
plac of the city, 9:15 To call passeng who go right on their
ways: 9:16 whoso is simple, let him turn in hither: and as for him
that wanteth understanding, she saith to him, 9:17 stolen water are
sweet, and bread eaten in secret is pleasant.

9:18 but he knoweth not that the dead are there; and that her guests
ar in the depth of hell.

10:1 the proverb of solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a
foolish son is the heavi of hi mother.

10:2 treasur of wicked profit nothing: but righteousness
delivereth from death.

10:3 the lord will not suffer the soul of the righteou to famish: but
h casteth away the substanc of the wicked.

10:4 He becometh poor that dealeth with a slack hand: but the hand of
th dilig maketh rich.

10:5 He that gathereth in summer is a wise son: but he that sleepeth
in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

10:6 bless are upon the head of the just: but violenc covereth
th mouth of the wicked.

10:7 the memori of the just is blessed: but the name of the wicked
shal rot.

10:8 the wise in heart will receiv commandments: but a prate fool
shal fall.

10:9 He that walketh uprightli walketh surely: but he that perverteth
hi way shall be known.

10:10 He that winketh with the eye causeth sorrow: but a prate fool
shal fall.

10:11 the mouth of a righteou man is a well of life: but violence
covereth the mouth of the wicked.

10:12 hatr stirreth up strifes: but love covereth all sins.

10:13 In the lip of him that hath understand wisdom is found: but
a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.

10:14 wise men lay up knowledge: but the mouth of the foolish is near
destruction.

10:15 the rich man' wealth is hi strong city: the destruct of the
poor is their poverty.

10:16 the labour of the righteou tendeth to life: the fruit of the
wick to sin.

10:17 He is in the way of life that keepeth instruction: but he that
refuseth reproof erreth.

10:18 He that hideth hatr with lie lips, and he that uttereth a
slander, is a fool.

10:19 In the multitud of word there wanteth not sin: but he that
refraineth hi lip is wise.

10:20 the tongu of the just is as choic silver: the heart of the
wick is littl worth.

10:21 the lip of the righteou feed many: but fool die for want of
wisdom.

10:22 the bless of the lord, it maketh rich, and he addeth no
sorrow with it.

10:23 It is as sport to a fool to do mischief: but a man of
understand hath wisdom.

10:24 the fear of the wicked, it shall come upon him: but the desire
of the righteou shall be granted.

10:25 As the whirlwind passeth, so is the wick no more: but the
right is an everlast foundation.

10:26 As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the
sluggard to them that send him.

10:27 the fear of the lord prolongeth days: but the year of the
wick shall be shortened.

10:28 the hope of the righteou shall be gladness: but the expectation
of the wick shall perish.

10:29 the way of the lord is strength to the upright: but destruction
shal be to the worker of iniquity.

10:30 the righteou shall never be removed: but the wick shall not
inhabit the earth.

10:31 the mouth of the just bringeth forth wisdom: but the froward
tongu shall be cut out.

10:32 the lip of the righteou know what is acceptable: but the mouth
of the wick speaketh frowardness.

11:1 A fals balanc is abomin to the lord: but a just weight is
hi delight.

11:2 when pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowli is
wisdom.

11:3 the integr of the upright shall guid them: but the
pervers of transgressor shall destroy them.

11:4 rich profit not in the day of wrath: but righteousness
delivereth from death.

11:5 the righteous of the perfect shall direct hi way: but the
wick shall fall by hi own wickedness.

11:6 the righteous of the upright shall deliv them: but
transgressor shall be taken in their own naughtiness.

11:7 when a wick man dieth, hi expect shall perish: and the
hop of unjust men perisheth.

11:8 the righteou is deliv out of trouble, and the wick cometh
in hi stead.

11:9 An hypocrit with hi mouth destroyeth hi neighbour: but through
knowledg shall the just be delivered.

11:10 when it goeth well with the righteous, the citi rejoiceth: and
when the wick perish, there is shouting.

11:11 By the bless of the upright the citi is exalted: but it is
overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

11:12 He that is void of wisdom despiseth hi neighbour: but a man of
understand holdeth hi peace.

11:13 A talebear revealeth secrets: but he that is of a faithful
spirit concealeth the matter.

11:14 where no counsel is, the peopl fall: but in the multitud of
counsellor there is safety.

11:15 He that is sureti for a stranger shall smart for it: and he that
hateth suretiship is sure.

11:16 A graciou woman retaineth honour: and strong men retain riches.

11:17 the merci man doeth good to hi own soul: but he that is
cruel troubleth hi own flesh.

11:18 the wick worketh a deceit work: but to him that soweth
right shall be a sure reward.

11:19 As righteous tendeth to life: so he that pursueth evil
pursueth it to hi own death.

11:20 they that are of a froward heart are abomin to the lord:
but such as are upright in their way are hi delight.

11:21 though hand join in hand, the wick shall not be unpunished:
but the seed of the righteou shall be delivered.

11:22 As a jewel of gold in a swine' snout, so is a fair woman which
i without discretion.

11:23 the desir of the righteou is onli good: but the expect of
th wick is wrath.

11:24 there is that scattereth, and yet increaseth; and there is that
withholdeth more than is meet, but it tendeth to poverty.

11:25 the liber soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall
b water also himself.

11:26 He that withholdeth corn, the peopl shall curs him: but
bless shall be upon the head of him that selleth it.

11:27 He that dilig seeketh good procureth favour: but he that
seeketh mischief, it shall come unto him.

11:28 He that trusteth in hi rich shall fall; but the righteous
shal flourish as a branch.

11:29 He that troubleth hi own hous shall inherit the wind: and the
fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

11:30 the fruit of the righteou is a tree of life; and he that
winneth soul is wise.

11:31 behold, the righteou shall be recompens in the earth: much
mor the wick and the sinner.

12:1 whoso loveth instruct loveth knowledge: but he that hateth
reproof is brutish.

12:2 A good man obtaineth favour of the lord: but a man of wicked
devic will he condemn.

12:3 A man shall not be establish by wickedness: but the root of the
right shall not be moved.

12:4 A virtuou woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh
asham is as rotten in hi bones.

12:5 the thought of the righteou are right: but the counsel of the
wick are deceit.

12:6 the word of the wick are to lie in wait for blood: but the
mouth of the upright shall deliv them.

12:7 the wick are overthrown, and are not: but the hous of the
right shall stand.

12:8 A man shall be commend accord to hi wisdom: but he that is
of a pervers heart shall be despised.

12:9 He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that
honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.

12:10 A righteou man regardeth the life of hi beast: but the tender
merci of the wick are cruel.

12:11 He that tilleth hi land shall be satisfi with bread: but he
that followeth vain person is void of understanding.

12:12 the wick desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the
right yieldeth fruit.

12:13 the wick is snare by the transgress of hi lips: but the
just shall come out of trouble.

12:14 A man shall be satisfi with good by the fruit of hi mouth:
and the recomp of a man' hand shall be render unto him.

12:15 the way of a fool is right in hi own eyes: but he that
hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.

12:16 A fool' wrath is present known: but a prudent man covereth
shame.

12:17 He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false
wit deceit.

12:18 there is that speaketh like the pierc of a sword: but the
tongu of the wise is health.

12:19 the lip of truth shall be establish for ever: but a lying
tongu is but for a moment.

12:20 deceit is in the heart of them that imagin evil: but to the
counsellor of peac is joy.

12:21 there shall no evil happen to the just: but the wick shall be
fil with mischief.

12:22 ly lip are abomin to the lord: but they that deal truly
ar hi delight.

12:23 A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools
proclaimeth foolishness.

12:24 the hand of the dilig shall bear rule: but the sloth shall
b under tribute.

12:25 heavi in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word
maketh it glad.

12:26 the righteou is more excel than hi neighbour: but the way
of the wick seduceth them.

12:27 the sloth man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but
th substanc of a dilig man is precious.

12:28 In the way of righteous is life: and in the pathway thereof
ther is no death.

13:1 A wise son heareth hi father' instruction: but a scorner
heareth not rebuke.

13:2 A man shall eat good by the fruit of hi mouth: but the soul of
th transgressor shall eat violence.

13:3 He that keepeth hi mouth keepeth hi life: but he that openeth
wid hi lip shall have destruction.

13:4 the soul of the sluggard desireth, and hath nothing: but the soul
of the dilig shall be made fat.

13:5 A righteou man hateth lying: but a wick man is loathsome, and
cometh to shame.

13:6 righteous keepeth him that is upright in the way: but
wicked overthroweth the sinner.

13:7 there is that maketh himself rich, yet hath nothing: there is
that maketh himself poor, yet hath great riches.

13:8 the ransom of a man' life are hi riches: but the poor heareth
not rebuke.

13:9 the light of the righteou rejoiceth: but the lamp of the wicked
shal be put out.

13:10 onli by pride cometh contention: but with the well advis is
wisdom.

13:11 wealth gotten by vaniti shall be diminished: but he that
gathereth by labour shall increase.

13:12 hope defer maketh the heart sick: but when the desir cometh,
it is a tree of life.

13:13 whoso despiseth the word shall be destroyed: but he that feareth
th command shall be rewarded.

13:14 the law of the wise is a fountain of life, to depart from the
snar of death.

13:15 good understand giveth favour: but the way of transgressors
i hard.

13:16 everi prudent man dealeth with knowledge: but a fool layeth open
hi folly.

13:17 A wick messeng falleth into mischief: but a faithful
ambassador is health.

13:18 poverti and shame shall be to him that refuseth instruction: but
h that regardeth reproof shall be honoured.

13:19 the desir accomplish is sweet to the soul: but it is
abomin to fool to depart from evil.

13:20 He that walketh with wise men shall be wise: but a companion of
fool shall be destroyed.

13:21 evil pursueth sinners: but to the righteou good shall be
repayed.

13:22 A good man leaveth an inherit to hi children' children:
and the wealth of the sinner is laid up for the just.

13:23 much food is in the tillag of the poor: but there is that is
destroy for want of judgment.

13:24 He that spareth hi rod hateth hi son: but he that loveth him
chasteneth him betimes.

13:25 the righteou eateth to the satisfi of hi soul: but the
belli of the wick shall want.

14:1 everi wise woman buildeth her house: but the foolish plucketh it
down with her hands.

14:2 He that walketh in hi upright feareth the lord: but he that
i pervers in hi way despiseth him.

14:3 In the mouth of the foolish is a rod of pride: but the lip of
th wise shall preserv them.

14:4 where no oxen are, the crib is clean: but much increas is by the
strength of the ox.

14:5 A faith wit will not lie: but a fals wit will utter
lies.

14:6 A scorner seeketh wisdom, and findeth it not: but knowledg is
easi unto him that understandeth.

14:7 Go from the presenc of a foolish man, when thou perceivest not
in him the lip of knowledge.

14:8 the wisdom of the prudent is to understand hi way: but the folly
of fool is deceit.

14:9 fool make a mock at sin: but among the righteou there is
favour.

14:10 the heart knoweth hi own bitterness; and a stranger doth not
intermeddl with hi joy.

14:11 the hous of the wick shall be overthrown: but the tabernacle
of the upright shall flourish.

14:12 there is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end
thereof are the way of death.

14:13 even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that
mirth is heaviness.

14:14 the backslid in heart shall be fill with hi own ways: and a
good man shall be satisfi from himself.

14:15 the simpl believeth everi word: but the prudent man looketh
wel to hi going.

14:16 A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool
rageth, and is confident.

14:17 He that is soon angri dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked
devic is hated.

14:18 the simpl inherit folly: but the prudent are crown with
knowledge.

14:19 the evil bow befor the good; and the wick at the gate of the
righteous.

14:20 the poor is hate even of hi own neighbour: but the rich hath
mani friends.

14:21 He that despiseth hi neighbour sinneth: but he that hath mercy
on the poor, happi is he.

14:22 Do they not err that devis evil? but merci and truth shall be
to them that devis good.

14:23 In all labour there is profit: but the talk of the lip tendeth
onli to penury.

14:24 the crown of the wise is their riches: but the foolish of
fool is folly.

14:25 A true wit delivereth souls: but a deceit witness
speaketh lies.

14:26 In the fear of the lord is strong confidence: and hi children
shal have a place of refuge.

14:27 the fear of the lord is a fountain of life, to depart from the
snar of death.

14:28 In the multitud of peopl is the king' honour: but in the want
of peopl is the destruct of the prince.

14:29 He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he that
i hasti of spirit exalteth folly.

14:30 A sound heart is the life of the flesh: but envi the rottenness
of the bones.

14:31 He that oppresseth the poor reproacheth hi maker: but he that
honoureth him hath merci on the poor.

14:32 the wick is driven away in hi wickedness: but the righteous
hath hope in hi death.

14:33 wisdom resteth in the heart of him that hath understanding: but
that which is in the midst of fool is made known.

14:34 righteous exalteth a nation: but sin is a reproach to any
people.

14:35 the king' favour is toward a wise servant: but hi wrath is
against him that causeth shame.

15:1 A soft answer turneth away wrath: but grievou word stir up
anger.

15:2 the tongu of the wise useth knowledg aright: but the mouth of
fool poureth out foolishness.

15:3 the eye of the lord are in everi place, behold the evil and
th good.

15:4 A wholesom tongu is a tree of life: but pervers therein is
a breach in the spirit.

15:5 A fool despiseth hi father' instruction: but he that regardeth
reproof is prudent.

15:6 In the hous of the righteou is much treasure: but in the
revenu of the wick is trouble.

15:7 the lip of the wise dispers knowledge: but the heart of the
foolish doeth not so.

15:8 the sacrific of the wick is an abomin to the lord: but
th prayer of the upright is hi delight.

15:9 the way of the wick is an abomin unto the lord: but he
loveth him that followeth after righteousness.

15:10 correct is grievou unto him that forsaketh the way: and he
that hateth reproof shall die.

15:11 hell and destruct are befor the lord: how much more then the
heart of the children of men?  15:12 A scorner loveth not one that
reproveth him: neither will he go unto the wise.

15:13 A merri heart maketh a cheer countenance: but by sorrow of
th heart the spirit is broken.

15:14 the heart of him that hath understand seeketh knowledge: but
th mouth of fool feedeth on foolishness.

15:15 all the day of the afflict are evil: but he that is of a
merri heart hath a continu feast.

15:16 better is littl with the fear of the lord than great treasure
and troubl therewith.

15:17 better is a dinner of herb where love is, than a stall ox and
hatr therewith.

15:18 A wrath man stirreth up strife: but he that is slow to anger
appeaseth strife.

15:19 the way of the sloth man is as an hedg of thorns: but the
way of the righteou is made plain.

15:20 A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish man despiseth his
mother.

15:21 folli is joy to him that is destitut of wisdom: but a man of
understand walketh uprightly.

15:22 without counsel purpos are disappointed: but in the multitude
of counsellor they are established.

15:23 A man hath joy by the answer of hi mouth: and a word spoken in
du season, how good is it!  15:24 the way of life is abov to the
wise, that he may depart from hell beneath.

15:25 the lord will destroy the hous of the proud: but he will
establish the border of the widow.

15:26 the thought of the wick are an abomin to the lord: but
th word of the pure are pleasant words.

15:27 He that is greedi of gain troubleth hi own house; but he that
hateth gift shall live.

15:28 the heart of the righteou studieth to answer: but the mouth of
th wick poureth out evil things.

15:29 the lord is far from the wicked: but he heareth the prayer of
th righteous.

15:30 the light of the eye rejoiceth the heart: and a good report
maketh the bone fat.

15:31 the ear that heareth the reproof of life abideth among the wise.

15:32 He that refuseth instruct despiseth hi own soul: but he that
heareth reproof getteth understanding.

15:33 the fear of the lord is the instruct of wisdom; and before
honour is humility.

16:1 the prepar of the heart in man, and the answer of the
tongue, is from the lord.

16:2 all the way of a man are clean in hi own eyes; but the lord
weigheth the spirits.

16:3 commit thi work unto the lord, and thi thought shall be
established.

16:4 the lord hath made all thing for himself: yea, even the wicked
for the day of evil.

16:5 everi one that is proud in heart is an abomin to the lord:
though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.

16:6 By merci and truth iniqu is purged: and by the fear of the
lord men depart from evil.

16:7 when a man' way pleas the lord, he maketh even hi enemi to
b at peac with him.

16:8 better is a littl with righteous than great revenu without
right.

16:9 A man' heart deviseth hi way: but the lord directeth hi steps.

16:10 A divin sentenc is in the lip of the king: hi mouth
transgresseth not in judgment.

16:11 A just weight and balanc are the lord's: all the weight of the
bag are hi work.

16:12 It is an abomin to king to commit wickedness: for the
thron is establish by righteousness.

16:13 righteou lip are the delight of kings; and they love him that
speaketh right.

16:14 the wrath of a king is as messeng of death: but a wise man
wil pacifi it.

16:15 In the light of the king' counten is life; and hi favour
i as a cloud of the latter rain.

16:16 how much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get
understand rather to be chosen than silver!  16:17 the highway of
th upright is to depart from evil: he that keepeth hi way preserveth
hi soul.

16:18 pride goeth befor destruction, and an haughti spirit befor a
fall.

16:19 better it is to be of an humbl spirit with the lowly, than to
divid the spoil with the proud.

16:20 He that handleth a matter wise shall find good: and whoso
trusteth in the lord, happi is he.

16:21 the wise in heart shall be call prudent: and the sweet of
th lip increaseth learning.

16:22 understand is a wellspr of life unto him that hath it: but
th instruct of fool is folly.

16:23 the heart of the wise teacheth hi mouth, and addeth learn to
hi lips.

16:24 pleasant word are as an honeycomb, sweet to the soul, and
health to the bones.

16:25 there is a way that seemeth right unto a man, but the end
thereof are the way of death.

16:26 He that laboureth laboureth for himself; for hi mouth craveth
it of him.

16:27 An ungodli man diggeth up evil: and in hi lip there is as a
burn fire.

16:28 A froward man soweth strife: and a whisper separateth chief
friends.

16:29 A violent man enticeth hi neighbour, and leadeth him into the
way that is not good.

16:30 He shutteth hi eye to devis froward things: move hi lips
h bringeth evil to pass.

16:31 the hoari head is a crown of glory, if it be found in the way of
righteousness.

16:32 He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he that
ruleth hi spirit than he that taketh a city.

16:33 the lot is cast into the lap; but the whole dispos thereof is
of the lord.

17:1 better is a dri morsel, and quiet therewith, than an house
ful of sacrific with strife.

17:2 A wise servant shall have rule over a son that causeth shame, and
shal have part of the inherit among the brethren.

17:3 the fine pot is for silver, and the furnac for gold: but the
lord trieth the hearts.

17:4 A wick doer giveth heed to fals lips; and a liar giveth ear to
a naughti tongue.

17:5 whoso mocketh the poor reproacheth hi maker: and he that is glad
at calam shall not be unpunished.

17:6 children' children are the crown of old men; and the glori of
children are their fathers.

17:7 excel speech becometh not a fool: much less do lie lip a
prince.

17:8 A gift is as a preciou stone in the eye of him that hath it:
whithersoev it turneth, it prospereth.

17:9 He that covereth a transgress seeketh love; but he that
repeateth a matter separateth veri friends.

17:10 A reproof entereth more into a wise man than an hundr stripes
into a fool.

17:11 An evil man seeketh onli rebellion: therefor a cruel messenger
shal be sent against him.

17:12 let a bear rob of her whelp meet a man, rather than a fool
in hi folly.

17:13 whoso rewardeth evil for good, evil shall not depart from his
house.

17:14 the begin of strife is as when one letteth out water:
therefor leav off contention, befor it be meddl with.

17:15 He that justifieth the wicked, and he that condemneth the just,
even they both are abomin to the lord.

17:16 wherefor is there a price in the hand of a fool to get wisdom,
se he hath no heart to it?  17:17 A friend loveth at all times,
and a brother is born for adversity.

17:18 A man void of understand striketh hands, and becometh surety
in the presenc of hi friend.

17:19 He loveth transgress that loveth strife: and he that exalteth
hi gate seeketh destruction.

17:20 He that hath a froward heart findeth no good: and he that hath a
pervers tongu falleth into mischief.

17:21 He that begetteth a fool doeth it to hi sorrow: and the father
of a fool hath no joy.

17:22 A merri heart doeth good like a medicine: but a broken spirit
drieth the bones.

17:23 A wick man taketh a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways
of judgment.

17:24 wisdom is befor him that hath understanding; but the eye of a
fool are in the end of the earth.

17:25 A foolish son is a grief to hi father, and bitter to her
that bare him.

17:26 also to punish the just is not good, nor to strike princ for
equity.

17:27 He that hath knowledg spareth hi words: and a man of
understand is of an excel spirit.

17:28 even a fool, when he holdeth hi peace, is count wise: and he
that shutteth hi lip is esteem a man of understanding.

18:1 through desir a man, have separ himself, seeketh and
intermeddleth with all wisdom.

18:2 A fool hath no delight in understanding, but that hi heart may
discov itself.

18:3 when the wick cometh, then cometh also contempt, and with
ignomini reproach.

18:4 the word of a man' mouth are as deep waters, and the wellspring
of wisdom as a flow brook.

18:5 It is not good to accept the person of the wicked, to overthrow
th righteou in judgment.

18:6 A fool' lip enter into contention, and hi mouth calleth for
strokes.

18:7 A fool' mouth is hi destruction, and hi lip are the snare of
hi soul.

18:8 the word of a talebear are as wounds, and they go down into
th innermost part of the belly.

18:9 He also that is sloth in hi work is brother to him that is a
great waster.

18:10 the name of the lord is a strong tower: the righteou runneth
into it, and is safe.

18:11 the rich man' wealth is hi strong city, and as an high wall in
hi own conceit.

18:12 befor destruct the heart of man is haughty, and before
honour is humility.

18:13 He that answereth a matter befor he heareth it, it is folli and
sham unto him.

18:14 the spirit of a man will sustain hi infirmity; but a wounded
spirit who can bear?  18:15 the heart of the prudent getteth
knowledge; and the ear of the wise seeketh knowledge.

18:16 A man' gift maketh room for him, and bringeth him befor great
men.

18:17 He that is first in hi own caus seemeth just; but his
neighbour cometh and searcheth him.

18:18 the lot causeth content to cease, and parteth between the
mighty.

18:19 A brother offend is harder to be won than a strong city: and
their content are like the bar of a castle.

18:20 A man' belli shall be satisfi with the fruit of hi mouth;
and with the increas of hi lip shall he be filled.

18:21 death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that
lov it shall eat the fruit thereof.

18:22 whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing, and obtaineth favour
of the lord.

18:23 the poor useth intreaties; but the rich answereth roughly.

18:24 A man that hath friend must shew himself friendly: and there is
a friend that sticketh closer than a brother.

19:1 better is the poor that walketh in hi integrity, than he that is
pervers in hi lips, and is a fool.

19:2 also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he
that hasteth with hi feet sinneth.

19:3 the foolish of man perverteth hi way: and hi heart fretteth
against the lord.

19:4 wealth maketh mani friends; but the poor is separ from his
neighbour.

19:5 A fals wit shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh
li shall not escape.

19:6 mani will intreat the favour of the prince: and everi man is a
friend to him that giveth gifts.

19:7 all the brethren of the poor do hate him: how much more do his
friend go far from him? he pursueth them with words, yet they are
w to him.

19:8 He that getteth wisdom loveth hi own soul: he that keepeth
understand shall find good.

19:9 A fals wit shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh
li shall perish.

19:10 delight is not seemli for a fool; much less for a servant to
hav rule over princes.

19:11 the discret of a man deferreth hi anger; and it is hi glory
to pass over a transgression.

19:12 the king' wrath is as the roar of a lion; but hi favour is
a dew upon the grass.

19:13 A foolish son is the calam of hi father: and the contentions
of a wife are a continu dropping.

19:14 hous and rich are the inherit of fathers: and a prudent
wif is from the lord.

19:15 sloth casteth into a deep sleep; and an idl soul shall
suff hunger.

19:16 He that keepeth the command keepeth hi own soul; but he
that despiseth hi way shall die.

19:17 He that hath piti upon the poor lendeth unto the lord; and that
which he hath given will he pay him again.

19:18 chasten thi son while there is hope, and let not thi soul spare
for hi crying.

19:19 A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if thou
deliv him, yet thou must do it again.

19:20 hear counsel, and receiv instruction, that thou mayest be wise
in thi latter end.

19:21 there are mani devic in a man' heart; nevertheless the
counsel of the lord, that shall stand.

19:22 the desir of a man is hi kindness: and a poor man is better
than a liar.

19:23 the fear of the lord tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall
abid satisfied; he shall not be visit with evil.

19:24 A sloth man hideth hi hand in hi bosom, and will not so
much as bring it to hi mouth again.

19:25 smite a scorner, and the simpl will beware: and reprov one
that hath understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

19:26 He that wasteth hi father, and chaseth away hi mother, is a
son that causeth shame, and bringeth reproach.

19:27 cease, my son, to hear the instruct that causeth to err from
th word of knowledge.

19:28 An ungodli wit scorneth judgment: and the mouth of the
wick devoureth iniquity.

19:29 judgment are prepar for scorners, and stripe for the back of
fools.

20:1 wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging: and whosoev is
deceiv therebi is not wise.

20:2 the fear of a king is as the roar of a lion: whoso provoketh
him to anger sinneth against hi own soul.

20:3 It is an honour for a man to ceas from strife: but everi fool
wil be meddling.

20:4 the sluggard will not plow by reason of the cold; therefor shall
h beg in harvest, and have nothing.

20:5 counsel in the heart of man is like deep water; but a man of
understand will draw it out.

20:6 most men will proclaim everi one hi own goodness: but a faithful
man who can find?  20:7 the just man walketh in hi integrity: his
children are bless after him.

20:8 A king that sitteth in the throne of judgment scattereth away all
evil with hi eyes.

20:9 who can say, I have made my heart clean, I am pure from my sin?
20:10 diver weights, and diver measures, both of them are alike
abomin to the lord.

20:11 even a child is known by hi doings, whether hi work be pure,
and whether it be right.

20:12 the hear ear, and the see eye, the lord hath made even
both of them.

20:13 love not sleep, lest thou come to poverty; open thine eyes, and
thou shalt be satisfi with bread.

20:14 It is naught, it is naught, saith the buyer: but when he is gone
hi way, then he boasteth.

20:15 there is gold, and a multitud of rubies: but the lip of
knowledg are a preciou jewel.

20:16 take hi garment that is sureti for a stranger: and take a
pledg of him for a strang woman.

20:17 bread of deceit is sweet to a man; but afterward hi mouth
shal be fill with gravel.

20:18 everi purpos is establish by counsel: and with good advice
mak war.

20:19 He that goeth about as a talebear revealeth secrets: therefore
meddl not with him that flattereth with hi lips.

20:20 whoso curseth hi father or hi mother, hi lamp shall be put
out in obscur darkness.

20:21 An inherit may be gotten hastili at the beginning; but the
end thereof shall not be blessed.

20:22 say not thou, I will recompens evil; but wait on the lord, and
h shall save thee.

20:23 diver weight are an abomin unto the lord; and a false
bal is not good.

20:24 man' go are of the lord; how can a man then understand his
own way?  20:25 It is a snare to the man who devoureth that which is
holy, and after vow to make enquiry.

20:26 A wise king scattereth the wicked, and bringeth the wheel over
them.

20:27 the spirit of man is the candl of the lord, search all the
inward part of the belly.

20:28 merci and truth preserv the king: and hi throne is upholden by
mercy.

20:29 the glori of young men is their strength: and the beauti of old
men is the grey head.

20:30 the blueness of a wound cleanseth away evil: so do stripe the
inward part of the belly.

21:1 the king' heart is in the hand of the lord, as the river of
water: he turneth it whithersoev he will.

21:2 everi way of a man is right in hi own eyes: but the lord
pondereth the hearts.

21:3 To do justic and judgment is more accept to the lord than
sacrifice.

21:4 An high look, and a proud heart, and the plow of the wicked,
i sin.

21:5 the thought of the dilig tend onli to plenteousness; but of
everi one that is hasti onli to want.

21:6 the get of treasur by a lie tongu is a vaniti toss to
and fro of them that seek death.

21:7 the robberi of the wick shall destroy them; becaus they refuse
to do judgment.

21:8 the way of man is froward and strange: but as for the pure, his
work is right.

21:9 It is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop, than with a
brawl woman in a wide house.

21:10 the soul of the wick desireth evil: hi neighbour findeth no
favour in hi eyes.

21:11 when the scorner is punished, the simpl is made wise: and when
th wise is instructed, he receiveth knowledge.

21:12 the righteou man wise considereth the hous of the wicked:
but god overthroweth the wick for their wickedness.

21:13 whoso stoppeth hi ear at the cri of the poor, he also shall
cri himself, but shall not be heard.

21:14 A gift in secret pacifieth anger: and a reward in the bosom
strong wrath.

21:15 It is joy to the just to do judgment: but destruct shall be
to the worker of iniquity.

21:16 the man that wandereth out of the way of understand shall
remain in the congreg of the dead.

21:17 He that loveth pleasur shall be a poor man: he that loveth wine
and oil shall not be rich.

21:18 the wick shall be a ransom for the righteous, and the
transgressor for the upright.

21:19 It is better to dwell in the wilderness, than with a contentious
and an angri woman.

21:20 there is treasur to be desir and oil in the dwell of the
wise; but a foolish man spendeth it up.

21:21 He that followeth after righteous and merci findeth life,
righteousness, and honour.

21:22 A wise man scaleth the citi of the mighty, and casteth down the
strength of the confid thereof.

21:23 whoso keepeth hi mouth and hi tongu keepeth hi soul from
troubles.

21:24 proud and haughti scorner is hi name, who dealeth in proud
wrath.

21:25 the desir of the sloth killeth him; for hi hand refus to
labour.

21:26 He coveteth greedili all the day long: but the righteou giveth
and spareth not.

21:27 the sacrific of the wick is abomination: how much more, when
h bringeth it with a wick mind?  21:28 A fals wit shall
perish: but the man that heareth speaketh constantly.

21:29 A wick man hardeneth hi face: but as for the upright, he
directeth hi way.

21:30 there is no wisdom nor understand nor counsel against the
lord.

21:31 the hors is prepar against the day of battle: but safeti is
of the lord.

22:1 A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches, and loving
favour rather than silver and gold.

22:2 the rich and poor meet together: the lord is the maker of them
all.

22:3 A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the
simpl pass on, and are punished.

22:4 By humil and the fear of the lord are riches, and honour, and
life.

22:5 thorn and snare are in the way of the froward: he that doth
keep hi soul shall be far from them.

22:6 train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he
wil not depart from it.

22:7 the rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrow is servant to the
lender.

22:8 He that soweth iniqu shall reap vanity: and the rod of his
ang shall fail.

22:9 He that hath a bounti eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of
hi bread to the poor.

22:10 cast out the scorner, and content shall go out; yea, strife
and reproach shall cease.

22:11 He that loveth pure of heart, for the grace of hi lip the
k shall be hi friend.

22:12 the eye of the lord preserv knowledge, and he overthroweth the
word of the transgressor.

22:13 the sloth man saith, there is a lion without, I shall be
slain in the streets.

22:14 the mouth of strang women is a deep pit: he that is abhor of
th lord shall fall therein.

22:15 foolish is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of
correct shall drive it far from him.

22:16 He that oppresseth the poor to increas hi riches, and he that
giveth to the rich, shall sure come to want.

22:17 bow down thine ear, and hear the word of the wise, and apply
thin heart unto my knowledge.

22:18 for it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they
shal withal be fit in thi lips.

22:19 that thi trust may be in the lord, I have made known to thee
thi day, even to thee.

22:20 have not I written to thee excel thing in counsel and
knowledge, 22:21 that I might make thee know the certainti of the
word of truth; that thou mightest answer the word of truth to them
that send unto thee?  22:22 rob not the poor, becaus he is poor:
neith oppress the afflict in the gate: 22:23 for the lord will
plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoil them.

22:24 make no friendship with an angri man; and with a furiou man
thou shalt not go: 22:25 lest thou learn hi ways, and get a snare to
thi soul.

22:26 Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are
sureti for debts.

22:27 If thou hast noth to pay, whi should he take away thi bed
from under thee?  22:28 remov not the ancient landmark, which thy
fath have set.

22:29 seest thou a man dilig in hi business? he shall stand before
kings; he shall not stand befor mean men.

23:1 when thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consid dilig what
i befor thee: 23:2 and put a knife to thi throat, if thou be a man
given to appetite.

23:3 Be not desir of hi dainties: for they are deceit meat.

23:4 labour not to be rich: ceas from thine own wisdom.

23:5 wilt thou set thine eye upon that which is not? for riches
certainli make themselv wings; they fli away as an eagl toward
heaven.

23:6 eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither
desir thou hi dainti meats: 23:7 for as he thinketh in hi heart, so
i he: eat and drink, saith he to thee; but hi heart is not with
thee.

23:8 the morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose
thi sweet words.

23:9 speak not in the ear of a fool: for he will despis the wisdom
of thi words.

23:10 remov not the old landmark; and enter not into the field of
th fatherless: 23:11 for their redeem is mighty; he shall plead
their caus with thee.

23:12 appli thine heart unto instruction, and thine ear to the words
of knowledge.

23:13 withhold not correct from the child: for if thou beatest him
with the rod, he shall not die.

23:14 thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliv hi soul
from hell.

23:15 My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even
mine.

23:16 yea, my rein shall rejoice, when thi lip speak right things.

23:17 let not thine heart envi sinners: but be thou in the fear of the
lord all the day long.

23:18 for sure there is an end; and thine expect shall not be
cut off.

23:19 hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guid thine heart in the
way.

23:20 Be not among winebibbers; among riotou eater of flesh: 23:21
for the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness
shal cloth a man with rags.

23:22 hearken unto thi father that begat thee, and despis not thy
moth when she is old.

23:23 buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction,
and understanding.

23:24 the father of the righteou shall greatli rejoice: and he that
begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

23:25 thi father and thi mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee
shal rejoice.

23:26 My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eye observ my ways.

23:27 for a whore is a deep ditch; and a strang woman is a narrow
pit.

23:28 she also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the
transgressor among men.

23:29 who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath
babbling? who hath wound without cause? who hath red of eyes?
23:30 they that tarri long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed
wine.

23:31 look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his
colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

23:32 At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an
adder.

23:33 thine eye shall behold strang women, and thine heart shall
utt pervers things.

23:34 yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the
sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

23:35 they have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I wa not sick; they
hav beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it
yet again.

24:1 Be not thou enviou against evil men, neither desir to be with
them.

24:2 for their heart studieth destruction, and their lip talk of
mischief.

24:3 through wisdom is an hous builded; and by understand it is
established: 24:4 and by knowledg shall the chamber be fill with
al preciou and pleasant riches.

24:5 A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledg increaseth
strength.

24:6 for by wise counsel thou shalt make thi war: and in multitud of
counsellor there is safety.

24:7 wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not hi mouth in the
gate.

24:8 He that deviseth to do evil shall be call a mischiev person.

24:9 the thought of foolish is sin: and the scorner is an
abomin to men.

24:10 If thou faint in the day of adversity, thi strength is small.

24:11 If thou forbear to deliv them that are drawn unto death, and
thos that are readi to be slain; 24:12 If thou sayest, behold, we
knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consid it? and he
that keepeth thi soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to
everi man accord to hi works?  24:13 My son, eat thou honey,
becaus it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thi taste:
24:14 So shall the knowledg of wisdom be unto thi soul: when thou
hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thi expect shall
not be cut off.

24:15 lay not wait, O wick man, against the dwell of the
righteous; spoil not hi rest place: 24:16 for a just man falleth
seven times, and riseth up again: but the wick shall fall into
mischief.

24:17 rejoic not when thine enemi falleth, and let not thine heart be
glad when he stumbleth: 24:18 lest the lord see it, and it displease
him, and he turn away hi wrath from him.

24:19 fret not thyself becaus of evil men, neither be thou enviou at
th wicked: 24:20 for there shall be no reward to the evil man; the
candl of the wick shall be put out.

24:21 My son, fear thou the lord and the king: and meddl not with
them that are given to change: 24:22 for their calam shall rise
suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?  24:23 these things
also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of person in
judgment.

24:24 He that saith unto the wicked, thou are righteous; him shall the
peopl curse, nation shall abhor him: 24:25 but to them that rebuke
him shall be delight, and a good bless shall come upon them.

24:26 everi man shall kiss hi lip that giveth a right answer.

24:27 prepar thi work without, and make it fit for thyself in the
field; and afterward build thine house.

24:28 Be not a wit against thi neighbour without cause; and
dec not with thi lips.

24:29 say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will
rend to the man accord to hi work.

24:30 I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the
man void of understanding; 24:31 and, lo, it wa all grown over with
thorns, and nettl had cover the face thereof, and the stone wall
thereof wa broken down.

24:32 then I saw, and consid it well: I look upon it, and
receiv instruction.

24:33 yet a littl sleep, a littl slumber, a littl fold of the
hand to sleep: 24:34 So shall thi poverti come as one that
travelleth; and thi want as an arm man.

25:1 these are also proverb of solomon, which the men of hezekiah
k of judah copi out.

25:2 It is the glori of god to conceal a thing: but the honour of
k is to search out a matter.

25:3 the heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of
k is unsearchable.

25:4 take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a
vessel for the finer.

25:5 take away the wick from befor the king, and hi throne shall
b establish in righteousness.

25:6 put not forth thyself in the presenc of the king, and stand not
in the place of great men: 25:7 for better it is that it be said unto
thee, come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the
pres of the princ whom thine eye have seen.

25:8 Go not forth hastili to strive, lest thou know not what to do in
th end thereof, when thi neighbour hath put thee to shame.

25:9 debat thi caus with thi neighbour himself; and discov not a
secret to another: 25:10 lest he that heareth it put thee to shame,
and thine infami turn not away.

25:11 A word fitli spoken is like appl of gold in pictur of
silver.

25:12 As an ear of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a
wis reprov upon an obedi ear.

25:13 As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful
messeng to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his
masters.

25:14 whoso boasteth himself of a fals gift is like cloud and wind
without rain.

25:15 By long forbear is a princ persuaded, and a soft tongue
breaketh the bone.

25:16 hast thou found honey? eat so much as is suffici for thee,
lest thou be fill therewith, and vomit it.

25:17 withdraw thi foot from thi neighbour' house; lest he be weary
of thee, and so hate thee.

25:18 A man that beareth fals wit against hi neighbour is a
maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

25:19 confid in an unfaith man in time of troubl is like a
broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

25:20 As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar
upon nitre, so is he that singeth song to an heavi heart.

25:21 If thine enemi be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be
thirsty, give him water to drink: 25:22 for thou shalt heap coal of
fir upon hi head, and the lord shall reward thee.

25:23 the north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angri counten a
backbit tongue.

25:24 It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a
brawl woman and in a wide house.

25:25 As cold water to a thirsti soul, so is good news from a far
country.

25:26 A righteou man fall down befor the wick is as a troubled
fountain, and a corrupt spring.

25:27 It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own
glori is not glory.

25:28 He that hath no rule over hi own spirit is like a citi that is
broken down, and without walls.

26:1 As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not
seemli for a fool.

26:2 As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse
causeless shall not come.

26:3 A whip for the horse, a bridl for the ass, and a rod for the
fool' back.

26:4 answer not a fool accord to hi folly, lest thou also be like
unto him.

26:5 answer a fool accord to hi folly, lest he be wise in hi own
conceit.

26:6 He that sendeth a messag by the hand of a fool cutteth off the
feet, and drinketh damage.

26:7 the leg of the lame are not equal: so is a parabl in the mouth
of fools.

26:8 As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth
honour to a fool.

26:9 As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable
in the mouth of fools.

26:10 the great god that form all thing both rewardeth the fool,
and rewardeth transgressors.

26:11 As a dog returneth to hi vomit, so a fool returneth to his
folly.

26:12 seest thou a man wise in hi own conceit? there is more hope of
a fool than of him.

26:13 the sloth man saith, there is a lion in the way; a lion is in
th streets.

26:14 As the door turneth upon hi hinges, so doth the sloth upon
hi bed.

26:15 the sloth hideth hi hand in hi bosom; it grieveth him to
br it again to hi mouth.

26:16 the sluggard is wiser in hi own conceit than seven men that can
rend a reason.

26:17 He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belong not to
him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

26:18 As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death, 26:19 so
i the man that deceiveth hi neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?
26:20 where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no
talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

26:21 As coal are to burn coals, and wood to fire; so is a
contenti man to kindl strife.

26:22 the word of a talebear are as wounds, and they go down into
th innermost part of the belly.

26:23 burn lip and a wick heart are like a potsherd cover with
silv dross.

26:24 He that hateth dissembleth with hi lips, and layeth up deceit
within him; 26:25 when he speaketh fair, believ him not: for there
ar seven abomin in hi heart.

26:26 whose hatr is cover by deceit, hi wicked shall be
shew befor the whole congregation.

26:27 whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a
stone, it will return upon him.

26:28 A lie tongu hateth those that are afflict by it; and a
flatt mouth worketh ruin.

27:1 boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day
may bring forth.

27:2 let anoth man prais thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger,
and not thine own lips.

27:3 A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool' wrath is
heavi than them both.

27:4 wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is abl to stand
befor envy?  27:5 open rebuk is better than secret love.

27:6 faith are the wound of a friend; but the kiss of an enemy
ar deceitful.

27:7 the full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungri soul every
bitt thing is sweet.

27:8 As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that
wandereth from hi place.

27:9 ointment and perfum rejoic the heart: so doth the sweet of
a man' friend by hearti counsel.

27:10 thine own friend, and thi father' friend, forsak not; neither
go into thi brother' hous in the day of thi calamity: for better is
a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

27:11 My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him
that reproacheth me.

27:12 A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the
simpl pass on, and are punished.

27:13 take hi garment that is sureti for a stranger, and take a
pledg of him for a strang woman.

27:14 He that blesseth hi friend with a loud voice, rise earli in
th morning, it shall be count a curs to him.

27:15 A continu drop in a veri raini day and a contenti woman
ar alike.

27:16 whosoev hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his
right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

27:17 iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the counten of his
friend.

27:18 whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he
that waiteth on hi master shall be honoured.

27:19 As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

27:20 hell and destruct are never full; so the eye of man are
nev satisfied.

27:21 As the fine pot for silver, and the furnac for gold; so is a
man to hi praise.

27:22 though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a
pestle, yet will not hi foolish depart from him.

27:23 Be thou dilig to know the state of thi flocks, and look well
to thi herds.

27:24 for rich are not for ever: and doth the crown endur to every
generation?  27:25 the hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth
itself, and herb of the mountain are gathered.

27:26 the lamb are for thi clothing, and the goat are the price of
th field.

27:27 and thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thi food, for the
food of thi household, and for the mainten for thi maidens.

28:1 the wick flee when no man pursueth: but the righteou are bold
a a lion.

28:2 for the transgress of a land mani are the princ thereof: but
bi a man of understand and knowledg the state thereof shall be
prolonged.

28:3 A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweep rain which
leaveth no food.

28:4 they that forsak the law prais the wicked: but such as keep the
law contend with them.

28:5 evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the lord
understand all things.

28:6 better is the poor that walketh in hi uprightness, than he that
i pervers in hi ways, though he be rich.

28:7 whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion
of riotou men shameth hi father.

28:8 He that by usuri and unjust gain increaseth hi substance, he
shal gather it for him that will piti the poor.

28:9 He that turneth away hi ear from hear the law, even his
pray shall be abomination.

28:10 whoso causeth the righteou to go astray in an evil way, he
shal fall himself into hi own pit: but the upright shall have good
th in possession.

28:11 the rich man is wise in hi own conceit; but the poor that hath
understand searcheth him out.

28:12 when righteou men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when
th wick rise, a man is hidden.

28:13 He that covereth hi sin shall not prosper: but whoso
confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.

28:14 happi is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his
heart shall fall into mischief.

28:15 As a roar lion, and a rang bear; so is a wick ruler over
th poor people.

28:16 the princ that wanteth understand is also a great oppressor:
but he that hateth covet shall prolong hi days.

28:17 A man that doeth violenc to the blood of ani person shall flee
to the pit; let no man stay him.

28:18 whoso walketh uprightli shall be saved: but he that is perverse
in hi way shall fall at once.

28:19 He that tilleth hi land shall have plenti of bread: but he that
followeth after vain person shall have poverti enough.

28:20 A faith man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh
hast to be rich shall not be innocent.

28:21 To have respect of person is not good: for for a piec of bread
that man will transgress.

28:22 He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not
that poverti shall come upon him.

28:23 He that rebuketh a man afterward shall find more favour than he
that flattereth with the tongue.

28:24 whoso robbeth hi father or hi mother, and saith, It is no
transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

28:25 He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that
putteth hi trust in the lord shall be made fat.

28:26 He that trusteth in hi own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh
wisely, he shall be delivered.

28:27 He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth
hi eye shall have mani a curse.

28:28 when the wick rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish,
th righteou increase.

29:1 he, that be often reprov hardeneth hi neck, shall suddenly
b destroyed, and that without remedy.

29:2 when the righteou are in authority, the peopl rejoice: but when
th wick beareth rule, the peopl mourn.

29:3 whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth hi father: but he that keepeth
compani with harlot spendeth hi substance.

29:4 the king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth
gift overthroweth it.

29:5 A man that flattereth hi neighbour spreadeth a net for hi feet.

29:6 In the transgress of an evil man there is a snare: but the
right doth sing and rejoice.

29:7 the righteou considereth the caus of the poor: but the wicked
regardeth not to know it.

29:8 scorn men bring a citi into a snare: but wise men turn away
wrath.

29:9 If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or
laugh, there is no rest.

29:10 the bloodthirsti hate the upright: but the just seek hi soul.

29:11 A fool uttereth all hi mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till
afterwards.

29:12 If a ruler hearken to lies, all hi servant are wicked.

29:13 the poor and the deceit man meet together: the lord
lighteneth both their eyes.

29:14 the king that faith judgeth the poor, hi throne shall be
establish for ever.

29:15 the rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself
bringeth hi mother to shame.

29:16 when the wick are multiplied, transgress increaseth: but
th righteou shall see their fall.

29:17 correct thi son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give
delight unto thi soul.

29:18 where there is no vision, the peopl perish: but he that keepeth
th law, happi is he.

29:19 A servant will not be correct by words: for though he
understand he will not answer.

29:20 seest thou a man that is hasti in hi words? there is more hope
of a fool than of him.

29:21 He that delic bringeth up hi servant from a child shall
hav him becom hi son at the length.

29:22 An angri man stirreth up strife, and a furiou man aboundeth in
transgression.

29:23 A man' pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the
humbl in spirit.

29:24 whoso is partner with a thief hateth hi own soul: he heareth
cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

29:25 the fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth hi trust in
th lord shall be safe.

29:26 mani seek the ruler' favour; but everi man' judgment cometh
from the lord.

29:27 An unjust man is an abomin to the just: and he that is
upright in the way is abomin to the wicked.

30:1 the word of agur the son of jakeh, even the prophecy: the man
spak unto ithiel, even unto ithiel and ucal, 30:2 sure I am more
brutish than ani man, and have not the understand of a man.

30:3 I neither learn wisdom, nor have the knowledg of the holy.

30:4 who hath ascend up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered
th wind in hi fists? who hath bound the water in a garment? who
hath establish all the end of the earth? what is hi name, and what
i hi son' name, if thou canst tell?  30:5 everi word of god is
pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

30:6 add thou not unto hi words, lest he reprov thee, and thou be
found a liar.

30:7 two thing have I requir of thee; deni me them not befor i
die: 30:8 remov far from me vaniti and lies: give me neither poverty
nor riches; feed me with food conveni for me: 30:9 lest I be full,
and deni thee, and say, who is the lord? or lest I be poor, and steal,
and take the name of my god in vain.

30:10 accus not a servant unto hi master, lest he curs thee, and
thou be found guilty.

30:11 there is a gener that curseth their father, and doth not
bless their mother.

30:12 there is a gener that are pure in their own eyes, and yet
i not wash from their filthiness.

30:13 there is a generation, O how lofti are their eyes! and their
eyelid are lift up.

30:14 there is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw
teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy
from among men.

30:15 the horseleach hath two daughters, crying, give, give. there are
thre thing that are never satisfied, yea, four thing say not, It is
enough: 30:16 the grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not
fil with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

30:17 the eye that mocketh at hi father, and despiseth to obey his
mother, the raven of the valley shall pick it out, and the young
eagl shall eat it.

30:18 there be three thing which are too wonder for me, yea, four
which I know not: 30:19 the way of an eagl in the air; the way of a
serp upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and
th way of a man with a maid.

30:20 such is the way of an adulter woman; she eateth, and wipeth
h mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

30:21 for three thing the earth is disquieted, and for four which it
cannot bear: 30:22 for a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he
i fill with meat; 30:23 for an odiou woman when she is married;
and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

30:24 there be four thing which are littl upon the earth, but they
ar exceed wise: 30:25 the ant are a peopl not strong, yet they
prepar their meat in the summer; 30:26 the coni are but a feeble
folk, yet make they their hous in the rocks; 30:27 the locust have
no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands; 30:28 the spider
taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.

30:29 there be three thing which go well, yea, four are come in
going: 30:30 A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not
away for any; 30:31 A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against
whom there is no rise up.

30:32 If thou hast done foolishli in lift up thyself, or if thou
hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thi mouth.

30:33 sure the churn of milk bringeth forth butter, and the
wring of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forc of wrath
bringeth forth strife.

31:1 the word of king lemuel, the propheci that hi mother taught
him.

31:2 what, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of
mi vows?  31:3 give not thi strength unto women, nor thi way to that
which destroyeth kings.

31:4 It is not for kings, O lemuel, it is not for king to drink wine;
nor for princ strong drink: 31:5 lest they drink, and forget the
law, and pervert the judgment of ani of the afflicted.

31:6 give strong drink unto him that is readi to perish, and wine unto
thos that be of heavi hearts.

31:7 let him drink, and forget hi poverty, and rememb hi miseri no
more.

31:8 open thi mouth for the dumb in the caus of all such as are
appoint to destruction.

31:9 open thi mouth, judg righteously, and plead the caus of the
poor and needy.

31:10 who can find a virtuou woman? for her price is far above
rubies.

31:11 the heart of her husband doth safe trust in her, so that he
shal have no need of spoil.

31:12 she will do him good and not evil all the day of her life.

31:13 she seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingli with her
hands.

31:14 she is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from
afar.

31:15 she riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her
household, and a portion to her maidens.

31:16 she considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her
hand she planteth a vineyard.

31:17 she girdeth her loin with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

31:18 she perceiveth that her merchandis is good: her candl goeth
not out by night.

31:19 she layeth her hand to the spindle, and her hand hold the
distaff.

31:20 she stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth
her hand to the needy.

31:21 she is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her
household are cloth with scarlet.

31:22 she maketh herself cover of tapestry; her cloth is silk
and purple.

31:23 her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the
eld of the land.

31:24 she maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles
unto the merchant.

31:25 strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoic in
tim to come.

31:26 she openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongu is the law
of kindness.
