giv their light: the sun shall be darken in hi go forth, and
th moon shall not caus her light to shine.

13:11 and I will punish the world for their evil, and the wick for
their iniquity; and I will caus the arrog of the proud to cease,
and will lay low the haughti of the terrible.

13:12 I will make a man more preciou than fine gold; even a man than
th golden wedg of ophir.

13:13 therefor I will shake the heavens, and the earth shall remove
out of her place, in the wrath of the lord of hosts, and in the day of
hi fierc anger.

13:14 and it shall be as the chase roe, and as a sheep that no man
taketh up: they shall everi man turn to hi own people, and flee every
on into hi own land.

13:15 everi one that is found shall be thrust through; and everi one
that is join unto them shall fall by the sword.

13:16 their children also shall be dash to piec befor their eyes;
their hous shall be spoiled, and their wive ravished.

13:17 behold, I will stir up the mede against them, which shall not
regard silver; and as for gold, they shall not delight in it.

13:18 their bow also shall dash the young men to pieces; and they
shal have no piti on the fruit of the womb; their eye shall not
spar children.

13:19 and babylon, the glori of kingdoms, the beauti of the chaldees'
excellency, shall be as when god overthrew sodom and gomorrah.

13:20 It shall never be inhabited, neither shall it be dwelt in from
gener to generation: neither shall the arabian pitch tent there;
neith shall the shepherd make their fold there.

13:21 but wild beast of the desert shall lie there; and their houses
shal be full of dole creatures; and owl shall dwell there, and
satyr shall danc there.

13:22 and the wild beast of the island shall cri in their desolate
houses, and dragon in their pleasant palaces: and her time is near to
come, and her day shall not be prolonged.

14:1 for the lord will have merci on jacob, and will yet choose
israel, and set them in their own land: and the stranger shall be
join with them, and they shall cleav to the hous of jacob.

14:2 and the peopl shall take them, and bring them to their place:
and the hous of israel shall possess them in the land of the lord for
serv and handmaids: and they shall take them captives, whose
capt they were; and they shall rule over their oppressors.

14:3 and it shall come to pass in the day that the lord shall give
the rest from thi sorrow, and from thi fear, and from the hard
bondag wherein thou wast made to serve, 14:4 that thou shalt take up
thi proverb against the king of babylon, and say, how hath the
oppressor ceased! the golden citi ceased!  14:5 the lord hath broken
th staff of the wicked, and the sceptr of the rulers.

14:6 He who smote the peopl in wrath with a continu stroke, he that
rul the nation in anger, is persecuted, and none hindereth.

14:7 the whole earth is at rest, and is quiet: they break forth into
singing.

14:8 yea, the fir tree rejoic at thee, and the cedar of lebanon,
saying, sinc thou art laid down, no feller is come up against us.

14:9 hell from beneath is move for thee to meet thee at thi coming:
it stirreth up the dead for thee, even all the chief one of the
earth; it hath rais up from their throne all the king of the
nations.

14:10 all they shall speak and say unto thee, art thou also become
weak as we? art thou becom like unto us?  14:11 thi pomp is brought
down to the grave, and the nois of thi viols: the worm is spread
und thee, and the worm cover thee.

14:12 how art thou fallen from heaven, O lucifer, son of the morning!
how art thou cut down to the ground, which didst weaken the nations!
14:13 for thou hast said in thine heart, I will ascend into heaven, i
wil exalt my throne abov the star of god: I will sit also upon the
mount of the congregation, in the side of the north: 14:14 I will
ascend abov the height of the clouds; I will be like the most high.

14:15 yet thou shalt be brought down to hell, to the side of the pit.

14:16 they that see thee shall narrowli look upon thee, and consider
thee, saying, Is thi the man that made the earth to tremble, that did
shak kingdoms; 14:17 that made the world as a wilderness, and
destroy the citi thereof; that open not the hous of his
prisoners?  14:18 all the king of the nations, even all of them, lie
in glory, everi one in hi own house.

14:19 but thou art cast out of thi grave like an abomin branch,
and as the raiment of those that are slain, thrust through with a
sword, that go down to the stone of the pit; as a carcas trodden
und feet.

14:20 thou shalt not be join with them in burial, becaus thou hast
destroy thi land, and slain thi people: the seed of evildo shall
nev be renowned.

14:21 prepar slaughter for hi children for the iniqu of their
fathers; that they do not rise, nor possess the land, nor fill the
fac of the world with cities.

14:22 for I will rise up against them, saith the lord of hosts, and
cut off from babylon the name, and remnant, and son, and nephew, saith
th lord.

14:23 I will also make it a possess for the bittern, and pool of
water: and I will sweep it with the besom of destruction, saith the
lord of hosts.

14:24 the lord of host hath sworn, saying, sure as I have thought,
so shall it come to pass; and as I have purposed, so shall it stand:
14:25 that I will break the assyrian in my land, and upon my mountains
tread him under foot: then shall hi yoke depart from off them, and
hi burden depart from off their shoulders.

14:26 thi is the purpos that is purpos upon the whole earth: and
thi is the hand that is stretch out upon all the nations.

14:27 for the lord of host hath purposed, and who shall disannul it?
and hi hand is stretch out, and who shall turn it back?  14:28 in
th year that king ahaz die wa thi burden.

14:29 rejoic not thou, whole palestina, becaus the rod of him that
smot thee is broken: for out of the serpent' root shall come forth a
cockatrice, and hi fruit shall be a fieri fli serpent.

14:30 and the firstborn of the poor shall feed, and the needi shall
li down in safety: and I will kill thi root with famine, and he shall
slay thi remnant.

14:31 howl, O gate; cry, O city; thou, whole palestina, art dissolved:
for there shall come from the north a smoke, and none shall be alone
in hi appoint times.

14:32 what shall one then answer the messeng of the nation? that
th lord hath found zion, and the poor of hi peopl shall trust in
it.

15:1 the burden of moab. becaus in the night Ar of moab is laid
waste, and brought to silence; becaus in the night kir of moab is
laid waste, and brought to silence; 15:2 He is gone up to bajith, and
to dibon, the high places, to weep: moab shall howl over nebo, and
ov medeba: on all their head shall be baldness, and everi beard cut
off.

15:3 In their street they shall gird themselv with sackcloth: on
th top of their houses, and in their streets, everi one shall howl,
weep abundantly.

15:4 and heshbon shall cry, and elealeh: their voic shall be heard
even unto jahaz: therefor the arm soldier of moab shall cri out;
hi life shall be grievou unto him.

15:5 My heart shall cri out for moab; hi fugit shall flee unto
zoar, an heifer of three year old: for by the mount up of luhith
with weep shall they go it up; for in the way of horonaim they
shal rais up a cri of destruction.

15:6 for the water of nimrim shall be desolate: for the hay is
with away, the grass faileth, there is no green thing.

15:7 therefor the abund they have gotten, and that which they
hav laid up, shall they carri away to the brook of the willows.

15:8 for the cri is gone round about the border of moab; the howling
thereof unto eglaim, and the howl thereof unto beerelim.

15:9 for the water of dimon shall be full of blood: for I will bring
mor upon dimon, lion upon him that escapeth of moab, and upon the
remn of the land.

16:1 send ye the lamb to the ruler of the land from sela to the
wilderness, unto the mount of the daughter of zion.

16:2 for it shall be, that, as a wander bird cast out of the nest,
so the daughter of moab shall be at the ford of arnon.

16:3 take counsel, execut judgment; make thi shadow as the night in
th midst of the noonday; hide the outcasts; bewray not him that
wandereth.

16:4 let mine outcast dwell with thee, moab; be thou a covert to them
from the face of the spoiler: for the extortion is at an end, the
spoil ceaseth, the oppressor are consum out of the land.

16:5 and in merci shall the throne be established: and he shall sit
upon it in truth in the tabernacl of david, judging, and seeking
judgment, and hast righteousness.

16:6 We have heard of the pride of moab; he is veri proud: even of his
haughtiness, and hi pride, and hi wrath: but hi lie shall not be
so.

16:7 therefor shall moab howl for moab, everi one shall howl: for the
found of kirhareseth shall ye mourn; sure they are stricken.

16:8 for the field of heshbon languish, and the vine of sibmah: the
lord of the heathen have broken down the princip plant thereof,
they are come even unto jazer, they wander through the wilderness:
h branch are stretch out, they are gone over the sea.

16:9 therefor I will bewail with the weep of jazer the vine of
sibmah: I will water thee with my tears, O heshbon, and elealeh: for
th shout for thi summer fruit and for thi harvest is fallen.

16:10 and glad is taken away, and joy out of the plenti field;
and in the vineyard there shall be no singing, neither shall there be
shouting: the treader shall tread out no wine in their presses; i
hav made their vintag shout to cease.

16:11 wherefor my bowel shall sound like an harp for moab, and mine
inward part for kirharesh.

16:12 and it shall come to pass, when it is seen that moab is weari on
th high place, that he shall come to hi sanctuari to pray; but he
shal not prevail.

16:13 thi is the word that the lord hath spoken concern moab since
that time.

16:14 but now the lord hath spoken, saying, within three years, as the
year of an hireling, and the glori of moab shall be contemned, with
al that great multitude; and the remnant shall be veri small and
feeble.

17:1 the burden of damascus. behold, damascu is taken away from being
a city, and it shall be a ruinou heap.

17:2 the citi of aroer are forsaken: they shall be for flocks, which
shal lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

17:3 the fortress also shall ceas from ephraim, and the kingdom from
damascus, and the remnant of syria: they shall be as the glori of the
children of israel, saith the lord of hosts.

17:4 and in that day it shall come to pass, that the glori of jacob
shal be made thin, and the fat of hi flesh shall wax lean.

17:5 and it shall be as when the harvestman gathereth the corn, and
reapeth the ear with hi arm; and it shall be as he that gathereth
ear in the valley of rephaim.

17:6 yet glean grape shall be left in it, as the shake of an
ol tree, two or three berri in the top of the uppermost bough,
four or five in the outmost fruit branch thereof, saith the lord
god of israel.

17:7 At that day shall a man look to hi maker, and hi eye shall
hav respect to the holi one of israel.

17:8 and he shall not look to the altars, the work of hi hands,
neith shall respect that which hi finger have made, either the
groves, or the images.

17:9 In that day shall hi strong citi be as a forsaken bough, and
an uppermost branch, which they left becaus of the children of
israel: and there shall be desolation.

17:10 becaus thou hast forgotten the god of thi salvation, and hast
not been mind of the rock of thi strength, therefor shalt thou
plant pleasant plants, and shalt set it with strang slips: 17:11 in
th day shalt thou make thi plant to grow, and in the morn shalt
thou make thi seed to flourish: but the harvest shall be a heap in the
day of grief and of desper sorrow.

17:12 woe to the multitud of mani people, which make a nois like the
nois of the seas; and to the rush of nations, that make a rushing
lik the rush of mighti waters!  17:13 the nation shall rush like
th rush of mani waters: but god shall rebuk them, and they shall
fle far off, and shall be chase as the chaff of the mountain before
th wind, and like a roll thing befor the whirlwind.

17:14 and behold at eveningtid trouble; and befor the morn he is
not.

thi is the portion of them that spoil us, and the lot of them that
rob us.

18:1 woe to the land shadow with wings, which is beyond the rivers
of ethiopia: 18:2 that sendeth ambassador by the sea, even in vessels
of bulrush upon the waters, saying, go, ye swift messengers, to a
nat scatter and peeled, to a peopl terribl from their beginning
hitherto; a nation mete out and trodden down, whose land the rivers
hav spoiled!  18:3 all ye inhabit of the world, and dweller on
th earth, see ye, when he lifteth up an ensign on the mountains; and
when he bloweth a trumpet, hear ye.

18:4 for so the lord said unto me, I will take my rest, and I will
consid in my dwell place like a clear heat upon herbs, and like a
cloud of dew in the heat of harvest.

18:5 for afor the harvest, when the bud is perfect, and the sour
grap is ripen in the flower, he shall both cut off the sprig with
prun hooks, and take away and cut down the branches.

18:6 they shall be left togeth unto the fowl of the mountains, and
to the beast of the earth: and the fowl shall summer upon them, and
al the beast of the earth shall winter upon them.

18:7 In that time shall the present be brought unto the lord of hosts
of a peopl scatter and peeled, and from a peopl terribl from
their begin hitherto; a nation mete out and trodden under foot,
whos land the river have spoiled, to the place of the name of the
lord of hosts, the mount zion.

19:1 the burden of egypt. behold, the lord rideth upon a swift cloud,
and shall come into egypt: and the idol of egypt shall be move at
hi presence, and the heart of egypt shall melt in the midst of it.

19:2 and I will set the egyptian against the egyptians: and they
shal fight everi one against hi brother, and everi one against his
neighbour; citi against city, and kingdom against kingdom.

19:3 and the spirit of egypt shall fail in the midst thereof; and i
wil destroy the counsel thereof: and they shall seek to the idols,
and to the charmers, and to them that have familiar spirits, and to
th wizards.

19:4 and the egyptian will I give over into the hand of a cruel lord;
and a fierc king shall rule over them, saith the lord, the lord of
hosts.

19:5 and the water shall fail from the sea, and the river shall be
wast and dri up.

19:6 and they shall turn the river far away; and the brook of
def shall be empti and dri up: the reed and flag shall
wither.

19:7 the paper reed by the brooks, by the mouth of the brooks, and
everi thing sown by the brooks, shall wither, be driven away, and be
no more.

19:8 the fisher also shall mourn, and all they that cast angl into
th brook shall lament, and they that spread net upon the waters
shal languish.

19:9 moreov they that work in fine flax, and they that weave
networks, shall be confounded.

19:10 and they shall be broken in the purpos thereof, all that make
sluic and pond for fish.

19:11 sure the princ of zoan are fools, the counsel of the wise
counsellor of pharaoh is becom brutish: how say ye unto pharaoh, i
am the son of the wise, the son of ancient kings?  19:12 where are
they? where are thi wise men? and let them tell thee now, and let them
know what the lord of host hath purpos upon egypt.

19:13 the princ of zoan are becom fools, the princ of noph are
deceived; they have also seduc egypt, even they that are the stay of
th tribe thereof.

19:14 the lord hath mingl a pervers spirit in the midst thereof:
and they have caus egypt to err in everi work thereof, as a drunken
man staggereth in hi vomit.

19:15 neither shall there be ani work for egypt, which the head or
tail, branch or rush, may do.

19:16 In that day shall egypt be like unto women: and it shall be
afraid and fear becaus of the shake of the hand of the lord of
hosts, which he shaketh over it.

19:17 and the land of judah shall be a terror unto egypt, everi one
that maketh mention thereof shall be afraid in himself, becaus of the
counsel of the lord of hosts, which he hath determin against it.

19:18 In that day shall five citi in the land of egypt speak the
languag of canaan, and swear to the lord of hosts; one shall be
called, the citi of destruction.

19:19 In that day shall there be an altar to the lord in the midst of
th land of egypt, and a pillar at the border thereof to the lord.

19:20 and it shall be for a sign and for a wit unto the lord of
host in the land of egypt: for they shall cri unto the lord because
of the oppressors, and he shall send them a saviour, and a great one,
and he shall deliv them.

19:21 and the lord shall be known to egypt, and the egyptian shall
know the lord in that day, and shall do sacrific and oblation; yea,
they shall vow a vow unto the lord, and perform it.

19:22 and the lord shall smite egypt: he shall smite and heal it: and
they shall return even to the lord, and he shall be intreat of them,
and shall heal them.

19:23 In that day shall there be a highway out of egypt to assyria,
and the assyrian shall come into egypt, and the egyptian into assyria,
and the egyptian shall serv with the assyrians.

19:24 In that day shall israel be the third with egypt and with
assyria, even a bless in the midst of the land: 19:25 whom the lord
of host shall bless, saying, bless be egypt my people, and assyria
th work of my hands, and israel mine inheritance.

20:1 In the year that tartan came unto ashdod, (when sargon the king
of assyria sent him,) and fought against ashdod, and took it; 20:2 at
th same time spake the lord by isaiah the son of amoz, saying, Go and
loos the sackcloth from off thi loins, and put off thi shoe from thy
foot. and he did so, walk nake and barefoot.

20:3 and the lord said, like as my servant isaiah hath walk naked
and barefoot three year for a sign and wonder upon egypt and upon
ethiopia; 20:4 So shall the king of assyria lead away the egyptians
prisoners, and the ethiopian captives, young and old, nake and
barefoot, even with their buttock uncovered, to the shame of egypt.

20:5 and they shall be afraid and asham of ethiopia their
expectation, and of egypt their glory.

20:6 and the inhabit of thi isl shall say in that day, behold,
such is our expectation, whither we flee for help to be deliv from
th king of assyria: and how shall we escape?  21:1 the burden of the
desert of the sea. As whirlwind in the south pass through; so it
cometh from the desert, from a terribl land.

21:2 A grievou vision is declar unto me; the treacher dealer
dealeth treacherously, and the spoiler spoileth. Go up, O elam:
besiege, O media; all the sigh thereof have I made to cease.

21:3 therefor are my loin fill with pain: pang have taken hold
upon me, as the pang of a woman that travaileth: I wa bow down at
th hear of it; I wa dismay at the see of it.

21:4 My heart panted, fear affright me: the night of my
pleasur hath he turn into fear unto me.

21:5 prepar the table, watch in the watchtower, eat, drink: arise, ye
princes, and anoint the shield.

21:6 for thu hath the lord said unto me, go, set a watchman, let him
declar what he seeth.

21:7 and he saw a chariot with a coupl of horsemen, a chariot of
asses, and a chariot of camels; and he hearken dilig with much
heed: 21:8 and he cried, A lion: My lord, I stand continu upon the
watchtow in the daytime, and I am set in my ward whole nights: 21:9
and, behold, here cometh a chariot of men, with a coupl of horsemen.

and he answer and said, babylon is fallen, is fallen; and all the
graven imag of her god he hath broken unto the ground.

21:10 O my threshing, and the corn of my floor: that which I have
heard of the lord of hosts, the god of israel, have I declar unto
you.

21:11 the burden of dumah. He calleth to me out of seir, watchman,
what of the night? watchman, what of the night?  21:12 the watchman
said, the morn cometh, and also the night: if ye will enquire,
enquir ye: return, come.

21:13 the burden upon arabia. In the forest in arabia shall ye lodge,
o ye travel compani of dedanim.

21:14 the inhabit of the land of tema brought water to him that
wa thirsty, they prevent with their bread him that fled.

21:15 for they fled from the swords, from the drawn sword, and from
th bent bow, and from the grievous of war.

21:16 for thu hath the lord said unto me, within a year, accord to
th year of an hireling, and all the glori of kedar shall fail: 21:17
and the residu of the number of archers, the mighti men of the
children of kedar, shall be diminished: for the lord god of israel
hath spoken it.

22:1 the burden of the valley of vision. what aileth thee now, that
thou art wholli gone up to the housetops?  22:2 thou that art full of
stirs, a tumultu city, joyou city: thi slain men are not slain
with the sword, nor dead in battle.

22:3 all thi ruler are fled together, they are bound by the archers:
al that are found in thee are bound together, which have fled from
far.

22:4 therefor said I, look away from me; I will weep bitterly, labour
not to comfort me, becaus of the spoil of the daughter of my
people.

22:5 for it is a day of trouble, and of tread down, and of
perplex by the lord god of host in the valley of vision, breaking
down the walls, and of cri to the mountains.

22:6 and elam bare the quiver with chariot of men and horsemen, and
kir uncov the shield.

22:7 and it shall come to pass, that thi choicest valley shall be
ful of chariots, and the horsemen shall set themselv in array at
th gate.

22:8 and he discov the cover of judah, and thou didst look in
that day to the armour of the hous of the forest.

22:9 Ye have seen also the breach of the citi of david, that they
ar many: and ye gather togeth the water of the lower pool.

22:10 and ye have number the hous of jerusalem, and the houses
hav ye broken down to fortifi the wall.

22:11 Ye made also a ditch between the two wall for the water of the
old pool: but ye have not look unto the maker thereof, neither had
respect unto him that fashion it long ago.

22:12 and in that day did the lord god of host call to weeping, and
to mourning, and to baldness, and to gird with sackcloth: 22:13 and
behold joy and gladness, slay oxen, and kill sheep, eating
flesh, and drink wine: let us eat and drink; for to morrow we shall
die.

22:14 and it wa reveal in mine ear by the lord of hosts, surely
thi iniqu shall not be purg from you till ye die, saith the lord
god of hosts.

22:15 thu saith the lord god of hosts, go, get thee unto this
treasurer, even unto shebna, which is over the house, and say, 22:16
what hast thou here? and whom hast thou here, that thou hast hewed
the out a sepulchr here, as he that heweth him out a sepulchr on
high, and that graveth an habit for himself in a rock?  22:17
behold, the lord will carri thee away with a mighti captivity, and
wil sure cover thee.

22:18 He will sure violent turn and toss thee like a ball into a
larg country: there shalt thou die, and there the chariot of thy
glori shall be the shame of thi lord' house.

22:19 and I will drive thee from thi station, and from thi state shall
h pull thee down.

22:20 and it shall come to pass in that day, that I will call my
serv eliakim the son of hilkiah: 22:21 and I will cloth him with
thi robe, and strengthen him with thi girdle, and I will commit thy
govern into hi hand: and he shall be a father to the inhabitants
of jerusalem, and to the hous of judah.

22:22 and the key of the hous of david will I lay upon hi shoulder;
so he shall open, and none shall shut; and he shall shut, and none
shal open.

22:23 and I will fasten him as a nail in a sure place; and he shall be
for a gloriou throne to hi father' house.

22:24 and they shall hang upon him all the glori of hi father's
house, the offspr and the issue, all vessel of small quantity,
from the vessel of cups, even to all the vessel of flagons.

22:25 In that day, saith the lord of hosts, shall the nail that is
fasten in the sure place be removed, and be cut down, and fall; and
th burden that wa upon it shall be cut off: for the lord hath spoken
it.

23:1 the burden of tyre. howl, ye ship of tarshish; for it is laid
waste, so that there is no house, no enter in: from the land of
chittim it is reveal to them.

23:2 Be still, ye inhabit of the isle; thou whom the merchant of
zidon, that pass over the sea, have replenished.

23:3 and by great water the seed of sihor, the harvest of the river,
i her revenue; and she is a mart of nations.

23:4 Be thou ashamed, O zidon: for the sea hath spoken, even the
strength of the sea, saying, I travail not, nor bring forth children,
neith do I nourish up young men, nor bring up virgins.

23:5 As at the report concern egypt, so shall they be sore pained
at the report of tyre.

23:6 pass ye over to tarshish; howl, ye inhabit of the isle.

23:7 Is thi your joyou city, whose antiqu is of ancient days? her
own feet shall carri her afar off to sojourn.

23:8 who hath taken thi counsel against tyre, the crown city,
whos merchant are princes, whose traffick are the honour of
th earth?  23:9 the lord of host hath purpos it, to stain the
prid of all glory, and to bring into contempt all the honour of
th earth.

23:10 pass through thi land as a river, O daughter of tarshish: there
i no more strength.

23:11 He stretch out hi hand over the sea, he shook the kingdoms:
th lord hath given a command against the merchant city, to
destroy the strong hold thereof.

23:12 and he said, thou shalt no more rejoice, O thou oppressed
virgin, daughter of zidon: arise, pass over to chittim; there also
shalt thou have no rest.

23:13 behold the land of the chaldeans; thi peopl wa not, till the
assyrian found it for them that dwell in the wilderness: they set up
th tower thereof, they rais up the palac thereof; and he brought
it to ruin.

23:14 howl, ye ship of tarshish: for your strength is laid waste.

23:15 and it shall come to pass in that day, that tyre shall be
forgotten seventi years, accord to the day of one king: after the
end of seventi year shall tyre sing as an harlot.

23:16 take an harp, go about the city, thou harlot that hast been
forgotten; make sweet melody, sing mani songs, that thou mayest be
remembered.

23:17 and it shall come to pass after the end of seventi years, that
th lord will visit tyre, and she shall turn to her hire, and shall
commit fornic with all the kingdom of the world upon the face of
th earth.

23:18 and her merchandis and her hire shall be holi to the lord:
it shall not be treasur nor laid up; for her merchandis shall be
for them that dwell befor the lord, to eat sufficiently, and for
dur clothing.

24:1 behold, the lord maketh the earth empty, and maketh it waste, and
turneth it upsid down, and scattereth abroad the inhabit thereof.

24:2 and it shall be, as with the people, so with the priest; as with
th servant, so with hi master; as with the maid, so with her
mistress; as with the buyer, so with the seller; as with the lender,
so with the borrower; as with the taker of usury, so with the giver of
usuri to him.

24:3 the land shall be utterli emptied, and utterli spoiled: for the
lord hath spoken thi word.

24:4 the earth mourneth and fadeth away, the world languisheth and
fadeth away, the haughti peopl of the earth do languish.

24:5 the earth also is defil under the inhabit thereof; because
they have transgress the laws, chang the ordinance, broken the
everlast covenant.

24:6 therefor hath the curs devour the earth, and they that dwell
therein are desolate: therefor the inhabit of the earth are
burned, and few men left.

24:7 the new wine mourneth, the vine languisheth, all the merryhearted
do sigh.

24:8 the mirth of tabret ceaseth, the nois of them that rejoice
endeth, the joy of the harp ceaseth.

24:9 they shall not drink wine with a song; strong drink shall be
bitt to them that drink it.

24:10 the citi of confus is broken down: everi hous is shut up,
that no man may come in.

24:11 there is a cri for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened,
th mirth of the land is gone.

24:12 In the citi is left desolation, and the gate is smitten with
destruction.

24:13 when thu it shall be in the midst of the land among the people,
ther shall be as the shake of an oliv tree, and as the gleaning
grap when the vintag is done.

24:14 they shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for the majesty
of the lord, they shall cri aloud from the sea.

24:15 wherefor glorifi ye the lord in the fires, even the name of the
lord god of israel in the isl of the sea.

24:16 from the uttermost part of the earth have we heard songs, even
glori to the righteous. but I said, My leanness, my leanness, woe unto
me! the treacher dealer have dealt treacherously; yea, the
treacher dealer have dealt veri treacherously.

24:17 fear, and the pit, and the snare, are upon thee, O inhabit of
th earth.

24:18 and it shall come to pass, that he who fleeth from the nois of
th fear shall fall into the pit; and he that cometh up out of the
midst of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for the window from on
high are open, and the foundat of the earth do shake.

24:19 the earth is utterli broken down, the earth is clean dissolved,
th earth is move exceedingly.

24:20 the earth shall reel to and fro like a drunkard, and shall be
remov like a cottage; and the transgress thereof shall be heavy
upon it; and it shall fall, and not rise again.

24:21 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the lord shall
punish the host of the high one that are on high, and the king of
th earth upon the earth.

24:22 and they shall be gather together, as prison are gathered
in the pit, and shall be shut up in the prison, and after mani days
shal they be visited.

24:23 then the moon shall be confounded, and the sun ashamed, when the
lord of host shall reign in mount zion, and in jerusalem, and before
hi ancient gloriously.

25:1 O lord, thou art my god; I will exalt thee, I will prais thy
name; for thou hast done wonder things; thi counsel of old are
faith and truth.

25:2 for thou hast made of a citi an heap; of a defenc citi a ruin:
a palac of stranger to be no city; it shall never be built.

25:3 therefor shall the strong peopl glorifi thee, the citi of the
terr nation shall fear thee.

25:4 for thou hast been a strength to the poor, a strength to the
needi in hi distress, a refug from the storm, a shadow from the
heat, when the blast of the terribl one is as a storm against the
wall.

25:5 thou shalt bring down the nois of strangers, as the heat in a
dri place; even the heat with the shadow of a cloud: the branch of the
terr one shall be brought low.

25:6 and in thi mountain shall the lord of host make unto all people
a feast of fat things, a feast of wine on the lees, of fat things
ful of marrow, of wine on the lee well refined.

25:7 and he will destroy in thi mountain the face of the covering
cast over all people, and the vail that is spread over all nations.

25:8 He will swallow up death in victory; and the lord god will wipe
away tear from off all faces; and the rebuk of hi peopl shall he
tak away from off all the earth: for the lord hath spoken it.

25:9 and it shall be said in that day, lo, thi is our god; we have
wait for him, and he will save us: thi is the lord; we have waited
for him, we will be glad and rejoic in hi salvation.

25:10 for in thi mountain shall the hand of the lord rest, and moab
shal be trodden down under him, even as straw is trodden down for the
dunghill.

25:11 and he shall spread forth hi hand in the midst of them, as he
that swimmeth spreadeth forth hi hand to swim: and he shall bring
down their pride togeth with the spoil of their hands.

25:12 and the fortress of the high fort of thi wall shall he bring
down, lay low, and bring to the ground, even to the dust.

26:1 In that day shall thi song be sung in the land of judah; We have
a strong city; salvat will god appoint for wall and bulwarks.

26:2 open ye the gates, that the righteou nation which keepeth the
truth may enter in.

26:3 thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stay on
thee: becaus he trusteth in thee.

26:4 trust ye in the lord for ever: for in the lord jehovah is
everlast strength: 26:5 for he bringeth down them that dwell on
high; the lofti city, he layeth it low; he layeth it low, even to the
ground; he bringeth it even to the dust.

26:6 the foot shall tread it down, even the feet of the poor, and the
step of the needy.

26:7 the way of the just is uprightness: thou, most upright, dost
weigh the path of the just.

26:8 yea, in the way of thi judgments, O lord, have we wait for
thee; the desir of our soul is to thi name, and to the remembr of
thee.

26:9 with my soul have I desir thee in the night; yea, with my
spirit within me will I seek thee early: for when thi judgment are in
th earth, the inhabit of the world will learn righteousness.

26:10 let favour be shew to the wicked, yet will he not learn
righteousness: in the land of upright will he deal unjustly, and
wil not behold the majesti of the lord.

26:11 lord, when thi hand is lift up, they will not see: but they
shal see, and be asham for their envi at the people; yea, the fire
of thine enemi shall devour them.

26:12 lord, thou wilt ordain peac for us: for thou also hast wrought
al our work in us.

26:13 O lord our god, other lord besid thee have had dominion over
us: but by thee onli will we make mention of thi name.

26:14 they are dead, they shall not live; they are deceased, they
shal not rise: therefor hast thou visit and destroy them, and
mad all their memori to perish.

26:15 thou hast increas the nation, O lord, thou hast increas the
nation: thou art glorified: thou hadst remov it far unto all the
end of the earth.

26:16 lord, in troubl have they visit thee, they pour out a
pray when thi chasten wa upon them.

26:17 like as a woman with child, that draweth near the time of her
delivery, is in pain, and crieth out in her pangs; so have we been in
thi sight, O lord.

26:18 We have been with child, we have been in pain, we have as it
wer brought forth wind; we have not wrought ani deliver in the
earth; neither have the inhabit of the world fallen.

26:19 thi dead men shall live, togeth with my dead bodi shall they
arise. awak and sing, ye that dwell in dust: for thi dew is as the
dew of herbs, and the earth shall cast out the dead.

26:20 come, my people, enter thou into thi chambers, and shut thy
door about thee: hide thyself as it were for a littl moment, until
th indign be overpast.

26:21 for, behold, the lord cometh out of hi place to punish the
inhabit of the earth for their iniquity: the earth also shall
disclos her blood, and shall no more cover her slain.

27:1 In that day the lord with hi sore and great and strong sword
shal punish leviathan the pierc serpent, even leviathan that
crook serpent; and he shall slay the dragon that is in the sea.

27:2 In that day sing ye unto her, A vineyard of red wine.

27:3 I the lord do keep it; I will water it everi moment: lest any
hurt it, I will keep it night and day.

27:4 furi is not in me: who would set the brier and thorn against me
in battle? I would go through them, I would burn them together.

27:5 Or let him take hold of my strength, that he may make peac with
me; and he shall make peac with me.

27:6 He shall caus them that come of jacob to take root: israel shall
blossom and bud, and fill the face of the world with fruit.

27:7 hath he smitten him, as he smote those that smote him? or is he
slain accord to the slaughter of them that are slain by him?  27:8
in measure, when it shooteth forth, thou wilt debat with it: he
stayeth hi rough wind in the day of the east wind.

27:9 By thi therefor shall the iniqu of jacob be purged; and this
i all the fruit to take away hi sin; when he maketh all the stones
of the altar as chalkston that are beaten in sunder, the grove and
imag shall not stand up.

27:10 yet the defenc citi shall be desolate, and the habitation
forsaken, and left like a wilderness: there shall the calf feed, and
ther shall he lie down, and consum the branch thereof.

27:11 when the bough thereof are withered, they shall be broken off:
th women come, and set them on fire: for it is a peopl of no
understanding: therefor he that made them will not have merci on
them, and he that form them will shew them no favour.

27:12 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the lord shall beat
off from the channel of the river unto the stream of egypt, and ye
shal be gather one by one, O ye children of israel.

27:13 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the great trumpet
shal be blown, and they shall come which were readi to perish in the
land of assyria, and the outcast in the land of egypt, and shall
worship the lord in the holi mount at jerusalem.

28:1 woe to the crown of pride, to the drunkard of ephraim, whose
glori beauti is a fade flower, which are on the head of the fat
valley of them that are overcom with wine!  28:2 behold, the lord
hath a mighti and strong one, which as a tempest of hail and a
destroy storm, as a flood of mighti water overflowing, shall cast
down to the earth with the hand.

28:3 the crown of pride, the drunkard of ephraim, shall be trodden
und feet: 28:4 and the gloriou beauty, which is on the head of the
fat valley, shall be a fade flower, and as the hasti fruit before
th summer; which when he that looketh upon it seeth, while it is yet
in hi hand he eateth it up.

28:5 In that day shall the lord of host be for a crown of glory, and
for a diadem of beauty, unto the residu of hi people, 28:6 and for a
spirit of judgment to him that sitteth in judgment, and for strength
to them that turn the battl to the gate.

28:7 but they also have er through wine, and through strong drink
ar out of the way; the priest and the prophet have er through
strong drink, they are swallow up of wine, they are out of the way
through strong drink; they err in vision, they stumbl in judgment.

28:8 for all tabl are full of vomit and filthiness, so that there is
no place clean.

28:9 whom shall he teach knowledge? and whom shall he make to
understand doctrine? them that are wean from the milk, and drawn
from the breasts.

28:10 for precept must be upon precept, precept upon precept; line
upon line, line upon line; here a little, and there a little: 28:11
for with stammer lip and anoth tongu will he speak to this
people.

28:12 To whom he said, thi is the rest wherewith ye may caus the
weari to rest; and thi is the refreshing: yet they would not hear.

28:13 but the word of the lord wa unto them precept upon precept,
precept upon precept; line upon line, line upon line; here a little,
and there a little; that they might go, and fall backward, and be
broken, and snared, and taken.

28:14 wherefor hear the word of the lord, ye scorn men, that rule
thi peopl which is in jerusalem.

28:15 becaus ye have said, We have made a coven with death, and
with hell are we at agreement; when the overflow scourg shall pass
through, it shall not come unto us: for we have made lie our refuge,
and under falsehood have we hid ourselves: 28:16 therefor thu saith
th lord god, behold, I lay in zion for a foundat a stone, a tried
stone, a preciou corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth
shal not make haste.

28:17 judgment also will I lay to the line, and righteous to the
plummet: and the hail shall sweep away the refug of lies, and the
wat shall overflow the hide place.

28:18 and your coven with death shall be disannulled, and your
agr with hell shall not stand; when the overflow scourge
shal pass through, then ye shall be trodden down by it.

28:19 from the time that it goeth forth it shall take you: for morning
bi morn shall it pass over, by day and by night: and it shall be a
vex onli to understand the report.

28:20 for the bed is shorter than that a man can stretch himself on
it: and the cover narrow than that he can wrap himself in it.

28:21 for the lord shall rise up as in mount perazim, he shall be
wroth as in the valley of gibeon, that he may do hi work, hi strange
work; and bring to pass hi act, hi strang act.

28:22 now therefor be ye not mockers, lest your band be made strong:
for I have heard from the lord god of host a consumption, even
determin upon the whole earth.

28:23 give ye ear, and hear my voice; hearken, and hear my speech.

28:24 doth the plowman plow all day to sow? doth he open and break the
clod of hi ground?  28:25 when he hath made plain the face thereof,
doth he not cast abroad the fitches, and scatter the cummin, and cast
in the princip wheat and the appoint barley and the rie in their
place?  28:26 for hi god doth instruct him to discretion, and doth
teach him.

28:27 for the fitch are not thresh with a thresh instrument,
neith is a cart wheel turn about upon the cummin; but the fitches
ar beaten out with a staff, and the cummin with a rod.

28:28 bread corn is bruised; becaus he will not ever be thresh it,
nor break it with the wheel of hi cart, nor bruis it with his
horsemen.

28:29 thi also cometh forth from the lord of hosts, which is
wond in counsel, and excel in working.

29:1 woe to ariel, to ariel, the citi where david dwelt! add ye year
to year; let them kill sacrifices.

29:2 yet I will distress ariel, and there shall be heavi and
sorrow: and it shall be unto me as ariel.

29:3 and I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege
against thee with a mount, and I will rais fort against thee.

29:4 and thou shalt be brought down, and shalt speak out of the
ground, and thi speech shall be low out of the dust, and thi voice
shal be, as of one that hath a familiar spirit, out of the ground,
and thi speech shall whisper out of the dust.

29:5 moreov the multitud of thi stranger shall be like small dust,
and the multitud of the terribl one shall be as chaff that passeth
away: yea, it shall be at an instant suddenly.

29:6 thou shalt be visit of the lord of host with thunder, and with
earthquake, and great noise, with storm and tempest, and the flame of
devour fire.

29:7 and the multitud of all the nation that fight against ariel,
even all that fight against her and her munition, and that distress
her, shall be as a dream of a night vision.

29:8 It shall even be as when an hungri man dreameth, and, behold, he
eateth; but he awaketh, and hi soul is empty: or as when a thirsty
man dreameth, and, behold, he drinketh; but he awaketh, and, behold,
h is faint, and hi soul hath appetite: so shall the multitud of all
th nation be, that fight against mount zion.

29:9 stay yourselves, and wonder; cri ye out, and cry: they are
drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

29:10 for the lord hath pour out upon you the spirit of deep sleep,
and hath close your eyes: the prophet and your rulers, the seers
hath he covered.

29:11 and the vision of all is becom unto you as the word of a book
that is sealed, which men deliv to one that is learned, saying, read
this, I pray thee: and he saith, I cannot; for it is sealed: 29:12 and
th book is deliv to him that is not learned, saying, read this, i
pray thee: and he saith, I am not learned.

29:13 wherefor the lord said, forasmuch as thi peopl draw near me
with their mouth, and with their lip do honour me, but have removed
their heart far from me, and their fear toward me is taught by the
precept of men: 29:14 therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a
marvel work among thi people, even a marvel work and a
wonder: for the wisdom of their wise men shall perish, and the
understand of their prudent men shall be hid.

29:15 woe unto them that seek deep to hide their counsel from the
lord, and their work are in the dark, and they say, who seeth us? and
who knoweth us?  29:16 sure your turn of thing upsid down shall
b esteem as the potter' clay: for shall the work say of him that
mad it, He made me not? or shall the thing frame say of him that
fram it, He had no understanding?  29:17 Is it not yet a veri little
while, and lebanon shall be turn into a fruit field, and the
fruit field shall be esteem as a forest?  29:18 and in that day
shal the deaf hear the word of the book, and the eye of the blind
shal see out of obscurity, and out of darkness.

29:19 the meek also shall increas their joy in the lord, and the poor
among men shall rejoic in the holi one of israel.

29:20 for the terribl one is brought to nought, and the scorner is
consumed, and all that watch for iniqu are cut off: 29:21 that make
a man an offend for a word, and lay a snare for him that reproveth
in the gate, and turn asid the just for a thing of nought.

29:22 therefor thu saith the lord, who redeem abraham, concerning
th hous of jacob, jacob shall not now be ashamed, neither shall his
fac now wax pale.

29:23 but when he seeth hi children, the work of mine hands, in the
midst of him, they shall sanctifi my name, and sanctifi the holi one
of jacob, and shall fear the god of israel.

29:24 they also that er in spirit shall come to understanding, and
they that murmur shall learn doctrine.

30:1 woe to the rebelli children, saith the lord, that take
counsel, but not of me; and that cover with a covering, but not of my
spirit, that they may add sin to sin: 30:2 that walk to go down into
egypt, and have not ask at my mouth; to strengthen themselv in the
strength of pharaoh, and to trust in the shadow of egypt!  30:3
therefor shall the strength of pharaoh be your shame, and the trust
in the shadow of egypt your confusion.

30:4 for hi princ were at zoan, and hi ambassador came to hanes.

30:5 they were all asham of a peopl that could not profit them, nor
b an help nor profit, but a shame, and also a reproach.

30:6 the burden of the beast of the south: into the land of trouble
and anguish, from whenc come the young and old lion, the viper and
fieri fli serpent, they will carri their rich upon the shoulders
of young asses, and their treasur upon the bunch of camels, to a
peopl that shall not profit them.

30:7 for the egyptian shall help in vain, and to no purpose:
therefor have I cri concern this, their strength is to sit
still.

30:8 now go, write it befor them in a table, and note it in a book,
that it may be for the time to come for ever and ever: 30:9 that this
i a rebelli people, lie children, children that will not hear
th law of the lord: 30:10 which say to the seers, see not; and to the
prophets, prophesi not unto us right things, speak unto us smooth
things, prophesi deceits: 30:11 get you out of the way, turn asid out
of the path, caus the holi one of israel to ceas from befor us.

30:12 wherefor thu saith the holi one of israel, becaus ye despise
thi word, and trust in oppress and perverseness, and stay thereon:
30:13 therefor thi iniqu shall be to you as a breach readi to
fall, swell out in a high wall, whose break cometh suddenli at
an instant.

30:14 and he shall break it as the break of the potters' vessel
that is broken in pieces; he shall not spare: so that there shall not
b found in the burst of it a sherd to take fire from the hearth,
or to take water withal out of the pit.

30:15 for thu saith the lord god, the holi one of israel; in
return and rest shall ye be saved; in quiet and in confidence
shal be your strength: and ye would not.

30:16 but ye said, no; for we will flee upon horses; therefor shall
y flee: and, We will ride upon the swift; therefor shall they that
pursu you be swift.

30:17 one thousand shall flee at the rebuk of one; at the rebuk of
fiv shall ye flee: till ye be left as a beacon upon the top of a
mountain, and as an ensign on an hill.

30:18 and therefor will the lord wait, that he may be graciou unto
you, and therefor will he be exalted, that he may have merci upon
you: for the lord is a god of judgment: bless are all they that wait
for him.

30:19 for the peopl shall dwell in zion at jerusalem: thou shalt weep
no more: he will be veri graciou unto thee at the voic of thi cry;
when he shall hear it, he will answer thee.

30:20 and though the lord give you the bread of adversity, and the
wat of affliction, yet shall not thi teacher be remov into a
corn ani more, but thine eye shall see thi teachers: 30:21 and
thin ear shall hear a word behind thee, saying, thi is the way,
walk ye in it, when ye turn to the right hand, and when ye turn to the
left.

30:22 Ye shall defil also the cover of thi graven imag of
silver, and the ornament of thi molten imag of gold: thou shalt cast
them away as a menstruou cloth; thou shalt say unto it, get thee
hence.

30:23 then shall he give the rain of thi seed, that thou shalt sow the
ground withal; and bread of the increas of the earth, and it shall be
fat and plenteous: in that day shall thi cattl feed in large
pastures.

30:24 the oxen likewis and the young ass that ear the ground shall
eat clean provender, which hath been winnow with the shovel and with
th fan.

30:25 and there shall be upon everi high mountain, and upon everi high
hill, river and stream of water in the day of the great slaughter,
when the tower fall.

30:26 moreov the light of the moon shall be as the light of the sun,
and the light of the sun shall be sevenfold, as the light of seven
days, in the day that the lord bindeth up the breach of hi people,
and healeth the stroke of their wound.

30:27 behold, the name of the lord cometh from far, burn with his
anger, and the burden thereof is heavy: hi lip are full of
indignation, and hi tongu as a devour fire: 30:28 and hi breath,
a an overflow stream, shall reach to the midst of the neck, to
sift the nation with the siev of vanity: and there shall be a bridle
in the jaw of the people, caus them to err.

30:29 Ye shall have a song, as in the night when a holi solemn is
kept; and glad of heart, as when one goeth with a pipe to come
into the mountain of the lord, to the mighti one of israel.

30:30 and the lord shall caus hi gloriou voic to be heard, and
shal shew the light down of hi arm, with the indign of his
anger, and with the flame of a devour fire, with scattering, and
tempest, and hailstones.

30:31 for through the voic of the lord shall the assyrian be beaten
down, which smote with a rod.

30:32 and in everi place where the ground staff shall pass, which
th lord shall lay upon him, it shall be with tabret and harps: and
in battl of shake will he fight with it.

30:33 for tophet is ordain of old; yea, for the king it is prepared;
h hath made it deep and large: the pile thereof is fire and much
wood; the breath of the lord, like a stream of brimstone, doth kindle
it.

31:1 woe to them that go down to egypt for help; and stay on horses,
and trust in chariots, becaus they are many; and in horsemen, because
they are veri strong; but they look not unto the holi one of israel,
neith seek the lord!  31:2 yet he also is wise, and will bring evil,
and will not call back hi words: but will aris against the hous of
th evildoers, and against the help of them that work iniquity.

31:3 now the egyptian are men, and not god; and their hors flesh,
and not spirit. when the lord shall stretch out hi hand, both he that
helpeth shall fall, and he that is holpen shall fall down, and they
al shall fail together.

31:4 for thu hath the lord spoken unto me, like as the lion and the
young lion roar on hi prey, when a multitud of shepherd is
cal forth against him, he will not be afraid of their voice, nor
abas himself for the nois of them: so shall the lord of host come
down to fight for mount zion, and for the hill thereof.

31:5 As bird flying, so will the lord of host defend jerusalem;
defend also he will deliv it; and pass over he will preserve
it.

31:6 turn ye unto him from whom the children of israel have deeply
revolted.

31:7 for in that day everi man shall cast away hi idol of silver,
and hi idol of gold, which your own hand have made unto you for a
sin.

31:8 then shall the assyrian fall with the sword, not of a mighti man;
and the sword, not of a mean man, shall devour him: but he shall flee
from the sword, and hi young men shall be discomfited.

31:9 and he shall pass over to hi strong hold for fear, and his
princ shall be afraid of the ensign, saith the lord, whose fire is
in zion, and hi furnac in jerusalem.

32:1 behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princ shall
rul in judgment.

32:2 and a man shall be as an hide place from the wind, and a covert
from the tempest; as river of water in a dri place, as the shadow of
a great rock in a weari land.

32:3 and the eye of them that see shall not be dim, and the ear of
them that hear shall hearken.

32:4 the heart also of the rash shall understand knowledge, and the
tongu of the stammer shall be readi to speak plainly.

32:5 the vile person shall be no more call liberal, nor the churl
said to be bountiful.

32:6 for the vile person will speak villany, and hi heart will work
iniquity, to practis hypocrisy, and to utter error against the lord,
to make empti the soul of the hungry, and he will caus the drink of
th thirsti to fail.

32:7 the instrument also of the churl are evil: he deviseth wicked
devic to destroy the poor with lie words, even when the needy
speaketh right.

32:8 but the liber deviseth liber things; and by liber things
shal he stand.

32:9 rise up, ye women that are at ease; hear my voice, ye careless
daughters; give ear unto my speech.

32:10 mani day and year shall ye be troubled, ye careless women: for
th vintag shall fail, the gather shall not come.

32:11 tremble, ye women that are at ease; be troubled, ye careless
ones: strip you, and make you bare, and gird sackcloth upon your
loins.

32:12 they shall lament for the teats, for the pleasant fields, for
th fruit vine.

32:13 upon the land of my peopl shall come up thorn and briers; yea,
upon all the hous of joy in the joyou city: 32:14 becaus the
palac shall be forsaken; the multitud of the citi shall be left;
th fort and tower shall be for den for ever, a joy of wild asses,
a pastur of flocks; 32:15 until the spirit be pour upon us from on
high, and the wilder be a fruit field, and the fruit field
b count for a forest.

32:16 then judgment shall dwell in the wilderness, and righteousness
remain in the fruit field.

32:17 and the work of righteous shall be peace; and the effect of
right quiet and assur for ever.

32:18 and my peopl shall dwell in a peaceabl habitation, and in sure
dwellings, and in quiet rest places; 32:19 when it shall hail,
com down on the forest; and the citi shall be low in a low place.

32:20 bless are ye that sow besid all waters, that send forth
thith the feet of the ox and the ass.

33:1 woe to thee that spoilest, and thou wast not spoiled; and dealest
treacherously, and they dealt not treacher with thee! when thou
shalt ceas to spoil, thou shalt be spoiled; and when thou shalt make
an end to deal treacherously, they shall deal treacher with thee.

33:2 O lord, be graciou unto us; we have wait for thee: be thou
their arm everi morning, our salvat also in the time of trouble.

33:3 At the nois of the tumult the peopl fled; at the lift up of
thyself the nation were scattered.

33:4 and your spoil shall be gather like the gather of the
caterpiller: as the run to and fro of locust shall he run upon
them.

33:5 the lord is exalted; for he dwelleth on high: he hath fill zion
with judgment and righteousness.

33:6 and wisdom and knowledg shall be the stabil of thi times, and
strength of salvation: the fear of the lord is hi treasure.

33:7 behold, their valiant one shall cri without: the ambassador of
peac shall weep bitterly.

33:8 the highway lie waste, the wayfar man ceaseth: he hath broken
th covenant, he hath despis the cities, he regardeth no man.

33:9 the earth mourneth and languisheth: lebanon is asham and hewn
down: sharon is like a wilderness; and bashan and carmel shake off
their fruits.

33:10 now will I rise, saith the lord; now will I be exalted; now will
i lift up myself.

33:11 Ye shall conceiv chaff, ye shall bring forth stubble: your
breath, as fire, shall devour you.

33:12 and the peopl shall be as the burn of lime: as thorn cut
up shall they be burn in the fire.

33:13 hear, ye that are far off, what I have done; and, ye that are
near, acknowledg my might.

33:14 the sinner in zion are afraid; fear hath surpris the
hypocrites. who among us shall dwell with the devour fire? who
among us shall dwell with everlast burnings?  33:15 He that walketh
righteously, and speaketh uprightly; he that despiseth the gain of
oppressions, that shaketh hi hand from hold of bribes, that
stoppeth hi ear from hear of blood, and shutteth hi eye from
se evil; 33:16 He shall dwell on high: hi place of defenc shall
b the munit of rocks: bread shall be given him; hi water shall
b sure.

33:17 thine eye shall see the king in hi beauty: they shall behold
th land that is veri far off.

33:18 thine heart shall medit terror. where is the scribe? where is
th receiver? where is he that count the towers?  33:19 thou shalt
not see a fierc people, a peopl of a deeper speech than thou canst
perceive; of a stammer tongue, that thou canst not understand.

33:20 look upon zion, the citi of our solemnities: thine eye shall
se jerusalem a quiet habitation, a tabernacl that shall not be taken
down; not one of the stake thereof shall ever be removed, neither
shal ani of the cord thereof be broken.

33:21 but there the gloriou lord will be unto us a place of broad
riv and streams; wherein shall go no galley with oars, neither
shal gallant ship pass thereby.

33:22 for the lord is our judge, the lord is our lawgiver, the lord is
our king; he will save us.

33:23 thi tackl are loosed; they could not well strengthen their
mast, they could not spread the sail: then is the prey of a great
spoil divided; the lame take the prey.

33:24 and the inhabit shall not say, I am sick: the peopl that
dwel therein shall be forgiven their iniquity.

34:1 come near, ye nations, to hear; and hearken, ye people: let the
earth hear, and all that is therein; the world, and all thing that
com forth of it.

34:2 for the indign of the lord is upon all nations, and hi fury
upon all their armies: he hath utterli destroy them, he hath
deliv them to the slaughter.

34:3 their slain also shall be cast out, and their stink shall come up
out of their carcases, and the mountain shall be melt with their
blood.

34:4 and all the host of heaven shall be dissolved, and the heavens
shal be roll togeth as a scroll: and all their host shall fall
down, as the leaf falleth off from the vine, and as a fall fig from
th fig tree.

34:5 for my sword shall be bath in heaven: behold, it shall come
down upon idumea, and upon the peopl of my curse, to judgment.

34:6 the sword of the lord is fill with blood, it is made fat with
fatness, and with the blood of lamb and goats, with the fat of the
kidney of rams: for the lord hath a sacrific in bozrah, and a great
slaught in the land of idumea.

34:7 and the unicorn shall come down with them, and the bullock with
th bulls; and their land shall be soak with blood, and their dust
mad fat with fatness.

34:8 for it is the day of the lord' vengeance, and the year of
recomp for the controversi of zion.

34:9 and the stream thereof shall be turn into pitch, and the dust
thereof into brimstone, and the land thereof shall becom burning
pitch.

34:10 It shall not be quench night nor day; the smoke thereof shall
go up for ever: from gener to gener it shall lie waste; none
shal pass through it for ever and ever.

34:11 but the cormor and the bittern shall possess it; the owl also
and the raven shall dwell in it: and he shall stretch out upon it the
lin of confusion, and the stone of emptiness.

34:12 they shall call the nobl thereof to the kingdom, but none
shal be there, and all her princ shall be nothing.

34:13 and thorn shall come up in her palaces, nettl and brambl in
th fortress thereof: and it shall be an habit of dragons, and
a court for owls.

34:14 the wild beast of the desert shall also meet with the wild
beast of the island, and the satyr shall cri to hi fellow; the
screech owl also shall rest there, and find for herself a place of
rest.

34:15 there shall the great owl make her nest, and lay, and hatch, and
gath under her shadow: there shall the vultur also be gathered,
everi one with her mate.

34:16 seek ye out of the book of the lord, and read: no one of these
shal fail, none shall want her mate: for my mouth it hath commanded,
and hi spirit it hath gather them.

34:17 and he hath cast the lot for them, and hi hand hath divid it
unto them by line: they shall possess it for ever, from gener to
gener shall they dwell therein.

35:1 the wilder and the solitari place shall be glad for them; and
th desert shall rejoice, and blossom as the rose.

35:2 It shall blossom abundantly, and rejoic even with joy and
singing: the glori of lebanon shall be given unto it, the excellency
of carmel and sharon, they shall see the glori of the lord, and the
excel of our god.

35:3 strengthen ye the weak hands, and confirm the feebl knees.

35:4 say to them that are of a fear heart, Be strong, fear not:
behold, your god will come with vengeance, even god with a recompence;
h will come and save you.

35:5 then the eye of the blind shall be opened, and the ear of the
deaf shall be unstopped.

35:6 then shall the lame man leap as an hart, and the tongu of the
dumb sing: for in the wilder shall water break out, and streams
in the desert.

35:7 and the parch ground shall becom a pool, and the thirsti land
spr of water: in the habit of dragons, where each lay, shall
b grass with reed and rushes.

35:8 and an highway shall be there, and a way, and it shall be called
th way of holiness; the unclean shall not pass over it; but it shall
b for those: the wayfar men, though fools, shall not err therein.

35:9 No lion shall be there, nor ani raven beast shall go up
thereon, it shall not be found there; but the redeem shall walk
there: 35:10 and the ransom of the lord shall return, and come to
zion with song and everlast joy upon their heads: they shall
obtain joy and gladness, and sorrow and sigh shall flee away.

36:1 now it came to pass in the fourteenth year of king hezekiah, that
sennacherib king of assyria came up against all the defenc citi of
judah, and took them.

36:2 and the king of assyria sent rabshakeh from lachish to jerusalem
unto king hezekiah with a great army. and he stood by the conduit of
th upper pool in the highway of the fuller' field.

36:3 then came forth unto him eliakim, hilkiah' son, which wa over
th house, and shebna the scribe, and joah, asaph' son, the recorder.

36:4 and rabshakeh said unto them, say ye now to hezekiah, thu saith
th great king, the king of assyria, what confid is thi wherein
th trustest?  36:5 I say, sayest thou, (but they are but vain words)
i have counsel and strength for war: now on whom dost thou trust, that
thou rebellest against me?  36:6 lo, thou trustest in the staff of
thi broken reed, on egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his
hand, and pierc it: so is pharaoh king of egypt to all that trust in
him.

36:7 but if thou say to me, We trust in the lord our god: is it not
he, whose high place and whose altar hezekiah hath taken away, and
said to judah and to jerusalem, Ye shall worship befor thi altar?
36:8 now therefor give pledges, I pray thee, to my master the king of
assyria, and I will give thee two thousand horses, if thou be abl on
thi part to set rider upon them.

36:9 how then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least
of my master' servants, and put thi trust on egypt for chariot and
for horsemen?  36:10 and am I now come up without the lord against
thi land to destroy it? the lord said unto me, Go up against this
land, and destroy it.

36:11 then said eliakim and shebna and joah unto rabshakeh, speak, i
pray thee, unto thi servant in the syrian language; for we understand
it: and speak not to us in the jews' language, in the ear of the
peopl that are on the wall.

36:12 but rabshakeh said, hath my master sent me to thi master and to
the to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men that sit
upon the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own
piss with you?  36:13 then rabshakeh stood, and cri with a loud
voic in the jews' language, and said, hear ye the word of the great
king, the king of assyria.

36:14 thu saith the king, let not hezekiah deceiv you: for he shall
not be abl to deliv you.

36:15 neither let hezekiah make you trust in the lord, saying, the
lord will sure deliv us: thi citi shall not be deliv into the
hand of the king of assyria.

36:16 hearken not to hezekiah: for thu saith the king of assyria,
mak an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me: and eat ye
everi one of hi vine, and everi one of hi fig tree, and drink ye
everi one the water of hi own cistern; 36:17 until I come and take
y away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land
of bread and vineyards.

36:18 bewar lest hezekiah persuad you, saying, the lord will deliver
us.

hath ani of the god of the nation deliv hi land out of the hand
of the king of assyria?  36:19 where are the god of hamath and
arphad? where are the god of sepharvaim? and have they delivered
samaria out of my hand?  36:20 who are they among all the god of
thes lands, that have deliv their land out of my hand, that the
lord should deliv jerusalem out of my hand?  36:21 but they held
their peace, and answer him not a word: for the king' commandment
was, saying, answer him not.

36:22 then came eliakim, the son of hilkiah, that wa over the
household, and shebna the scribe, and joah, the son of asaph, the
recorder, to hezekiah with their cloth rent, and told him the words
of rabshakeh.

37:1 and it came to pass, when king hezekiah heard it, that he rent
hi clothes, and cover himself with sackcloth, and went into the
hous of the lord.

37:2 and he sent eliakim, who wa over the household, and shebna the
scribe, and the elder of the priest cover with sackcloth, unto
isaiah the prophet the son of amoz.

37:3 and they said unto him, thu saith hezekiah, thi day is a day of
trouble, and of rebuke, and of blasphemy: for the children are come to
th birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

37:4 It may be the lord thi god will hear the word of rabshakeh, whom
th king of assyria hi master hath sent to reproach the live god,
and will reprov the word which the lord thi god hath heard:
wherefor lift up thi prayer for the remnant that is left.

37:5 So the servant of king hezekiah came to isaiah.

37:6 and isaiah said unto them, thu shall ye say unto your master,
thu saith the lord, Be not afraid of the word that thou hast heard,
wherewith the servant of the king of assyria have blasphem me.

37:7 behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour,
and return to hi own land; and I will caus him to fall by the sword
in hi own land.

37:8 So rabshakeh returned, and found the king of assyria warring
against libnah: for he had heard that he wa depart from lachish.

37:9 and he heard say concern tirhakah king of ethiopia, He is come
forth to make war with thee. and when he heard it, he sent messengers
to hezekiah, saying, 37:10 thu shall ye speak to hezekiah king of
judah, saying, let not thi god, in whom thou trustest, deceiv thee,
saying, jerusalem shall not be given into the hand of the king of
assyria.

37:11 behold, thou hast heard what the king of assyria have done to
al land by destroy them utterly; and shalt thou be delivered?
37:12 have the god of the nation deliv them which my fathers
hav destroyed, as gozan, and haran, and rezeph, and the children of
eden which were in telassar?  37:13 where is the king of hamath, and
th king of arphad, and the king of the citi of sepharvaim, hena, and
ivah?  37:14 and hezekiah receiv the letter from the hand of the
messengers, and read it: and hezekiah went up unto the hous of the
lord, and spread it befor the lord.

37:15 and hezekiah pray unto the lord, saying, 37:16 O lord of
hosts, god of israel, that dwellest between the cherubims, thou art
th god, even thou alone, of all the kingdom of the earth: thou hast
mad heaven and earth.

37:17 inclin thine ear, O lord, and hear; open thine eyes, O lord,
and see: and hear all the word of sennacherib, which hath sent to
reproach the live god.

37:18 Of a truth, lord, the king of assyria have laid wast all the
nations, and their countries, 37:19 and have cast their god into the
fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men' hands, wood and
stone: therefor they have destroy them.

37:20 now therefore, O lord our god, save us from hi hand, that all
th kingdom of the earth may know that thou art the lord, even thou
only.

37:21 then isaiah the son of amoz sent unto hezekiah, saying, thus
saith the lord god of israel, wherea thou hast pray to me against
sennacherib king of assyria: 37:22 thi is the word which the lord
hath spoken concern him; the virgin, the daughter of zion, hath
despis thee, and laugh thee to scorn; the daughter of jerusalem
hath shaken her head at thee.

37:23 whom hast thou reproach and blasphemed? and against whom hast
thou exalt thi voice, and lift up thine eye on high? even against
th holi one of israel.

37:24 By thi servant hast thou reproach the lord, and hast said, by
th multitud of my chariot am I come up to the height of the
mountains, to the side of lebanon; and I will cut down the tall
cedar thereof, and the choic fir tree thereof: and I will enter
into the height of hi border, and the forest of hi carmel.

37:25 I have digged, and drunk water; and with the sole of my feet
hav I dri up all the river of the besieg places.

37:26 hast thou not heard long ago, how I have done it; and of ancient
times, that I have form it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou
shouldest be to lay wast defenc citi into ruinou heaps.

37:27 therefor their inhabit were of small power, they were
dismay and confounded: they were as the grass of the field, and as
th green herb, as the grass on the housetops, and as corn blasted
befor it be grown up.

37:28 but I know thi abode, and thi go out, and thi come in, and
thi rage against me.

37:29 becaus thi rage against me, and thi tumult, is come up into
min ears, therefor will I put my hook in thi nose, and my bridl in
thi lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

37:30 and thi shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat thi year such
a groweth of itself; and the second year that which springeth of the
same: and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and
eat the fruit thereof.

37:31 and the remnant that is escap of the hous of judah shall
again take root downward, and bear fruit upward: 37:32 for out of
jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escap out of mount
zion: the zeal of the lord of host shall do this.

37:33 therefor thu saith the lord concern the king of assyria, he
shal not come into thi city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come
befor it with shields, nor cast a bank against it.

37:34 By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall
not come into thi city, saith the lord.

37:35 for I will defend thi citi to save it for mine own sake, and
for my servant david' sake.

37:36 then the angel of the lord went forth, and smote in the camp of
th assyrian a hundr and fourscor and five thousand: and when they
aros earli in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

37:37 So sennacherib king of assyria departed, and went and returned,
and dwelt at nineveh.

37:38 and it came to pass, as he wa worship in the hous of
nisroch hi god, that adrammelech and sharez hi son smote him with
th sword; and they escap into the land of armenia: and esarhaddon
hi son reign in hi stead.

38:1 In those day wa hezekiah sick unto death. and isaiah the
prophet the son of amoz came unto him, and said unto him, thu saith
th lord, set thine hous in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.

38:2 then hezekiah turn hi face toward the wall, and pray unto
th lord, 38:3 and said, rememb now, O lord, I beseech thee, how i
hav walk befor thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have
don that which is good in thi sight. and hezekiah wept sore.

38:4 then came the word of the lord to isaiah, saying, 38:5 go, and
say to hezekiah, thu saith the lord, the god of david thi father, i
hav heard thi prayer, I have seen thi tears: behold, I will add unto
thi day fifteen years.

38:6 and I will deliv thee and thi citi out of the hand of the king
of assyria: and I will defend thi city.

38:7 and thi shall be a sign unto thee from the lord, that the lord
wil do thi thing that he hath spoken; 38:8 behold, I will bring
again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of
ahaz, ten degre backward. So the sun return ten degrees, by which
degre it wa gone down.

38:9 the write of hezekiah king of judah, when he had been sick, and
wa recov of hi sickness: 38:10 I said in the cut off of my
days, I shall go to the gate of the grave: I am depriv of the
residu of my years.

38:11 I said, I shall not see the lord, even the lord, in the land of
th living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabit of the
world.

38:12 mine age is departed, and is remov from me as a shepherd's
tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with
pin sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.

38:13 I reckon till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all
mi bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.

38:14 like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a
dove: mine eye fail with look upward: O lord, I am oppressed;
undertak for me.

38:15 what shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath
don it: I shall go softli all my year in the bitter of my soul.

38:16 O lord, by these thing men live, and in all these thing is the
lif of my spirit: so wilt thou recov me, and make me to live.

38:17 behold, for peac I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love
to my soul deliv it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast
al my sin behind thi back.

38:18 for the grave cannot prais thee, death can not celebr thee:
they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thi truth.

38:19 the living, the living, he shall prais thee, as I do thi day:
th father to the children shall make known thi truth.

38:20 the lord wa readi to save me: therefor we will sing my songs
to the string instrument all the day of our life in the hous of
th lord.

38:21 for isaiah had said, let them take a lump of figs, and lay it
for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.

38:22 hezekiah also had said, what is the sign that I shall go up to
th hous of the lord?  39:1 At that time merodachbaladan, the son of
baladan, king of babylon, sent letter and a present to hezekiah: for
h had heard that he had been sick, and wa recovered.

39:2 and hezekiah wa glad of them, and shew them the hous of his
preci things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the
preci ointment, and all the hous of hi armour, and all that was
found in hi treasures: there wa noth in hi house, nor in all his
dominion, that hezekiah shew them not.

39:3 then came isaiah the prophet unto king hezekiah, and said unto
him, what said these men? and from whenc came they unto thee? and
hezekiah said, they are come from a far countri unto me, even from
babylon.

39:4 then said he, what have they seen in thine house? and hezekiah
answered, all that is in mine hous have they seen: there is nothing
among my treasur that I have not shew them.

39:5 then said isaiah to hezekiah, hear the word of the lord of hosts:
39:6 behold, the day come, that all that is in thine house, and that
which thi father have laid up in store until thi day, shall be
carri to babylon: noth shall be left, saith the lord.

39:7 and of thi son that shall issu from thee, which thou shalt
beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuch in the palace
of the king of babylon.

39:8 then said hezekiah to isaiah, good is the word of the lord which
thou hast spoken. He said moreover, for there shall be peac and truth
in my days.

40:1 comfort ye, comfort ye my people, saith your god.

40:2 speak ye comfort to jerusalem, and cri unto her, that her
warfar is accomplished, that her iniqu is pardoned: for she hath
receiv of the lord' hand doubl for all her sins.

40:3 the voic of him that crieth in the wilderness, prepar ye the
way of the lord, make straight in the desert a highway for our god.

40:4 everi valley shall be exalted, and everi mountain and hill shall
b made low: and the crook shall be made straight, and the rough
plac plain: 40:5 and the glori of the lord shall be revealed, and
al flesh shall see it together: for the mouth of the lord hath spoken
it.

40:6 the voic said, cry. and he said, what shall I cry? all flesh is
grass, and all the goodli thereof is as the flower of the field:
40:7 the grass withereth, the flower fadeth: becaus the spirit of the
lord bloweth upon it: sure the peopl is grass.

40:8 the grass withereth, the flower fadeth: but the word of our god
shal stand for ever.

40:9 O zion, that bringest good tidings, get thee up into the high
mountain; O jerusalem, that bringest good tidings, lift up thi voice
with strength; lift it up, be not afraid; say unto the citi of
judah, behold your god!  40:10 behold, the lord god will come with
strong hand, and hi arm shall rule for him: behold, hi reward is
with him, and hi work befor him.

40:11 He shall feed hi flock like a shepherd: he shall gather the
lamb with hi arm, and carri them in hi bosom, and shall gentli lead
thos that are with young.

40:12 who hath measur the water in the hollow of hi hand, and
met out heaven with the span, and comprehend the dust of the earth
in a measure, and weigh the mountain in scales, and the hill in a
balance?  40:13 who hath direct the spirit of the lord, or be his
counsellor hath taught him?  40:14 with whom took he counsel, and who
instruct him, and taught him in the path of judgment, and taught him
knowledge, and shew to him the way of understanding?  40:15 behold,
th nation are as a drop of a bucket, and are count as the small
dust of the balance: behold, he taketh up the isl as a veri little
thing.

40:16 and lebanon is not suffici to burn, nor the beast thereof
suffici for a burnt offering.

40:17 all nation befor him are as nothing; and they are count to
him less than nothing, and vanity.

40:18 To whom then will ye liken god? or what like will ye compare
unto him?  40:19 the workman melteth a graven image, and the goldsmith
spreadeth it over with gold, and casteth silver chains.

40:20 He that is so impoverish that he hath no oblat chooseth a
tre that will not rot; he seeketh unto him a cun workman to
prepar a graven image, that shall not be moved.

40:21 have ye not known? have ye not heard? hath it not been told you
from the beginning? have ye not understood from the foundat of the
earth?  40:22 It is he that sitteth upon the circl of the earth, and
th inhabit thereof are as grasshoppers; that stretcheth out the
heaven as a curtain, and spreadeth them out as a tent to dwell in:
40:23 that bringeth the princ to nothing; he maketh the judg of
th earth as vanity.

40:24 yea, they shall not be planted; yea, they shall not be sown:
yea, their stock shall not take root in the earth: and he shall also
blow upon them, and they shall wither, and the whirlwind shall take
them away as stubble.

40:25 To whom then will ye liken me, or shall I be equal? saith the
holi one.

40:26 lift up your eye on high, and behold who hath creat these
things, that bringeth out their host by number: he calleth them all by
nam by the great of hi might, for that he is strong in power;
not one faileth.

40:27 whi sayest thou, O jacob, and speakest, O israel, My way is hid
from the lord, and my judgment is pass over from my god?  40:28 hast
thou not known? hast thou not heard, that the everlast god, the
