lord, the creator of the end of the earth, fainteth not, neither is
weary? there is no search of hi understanding.

40:29 He giveth power to the faint; and to them that have no might he
increaseth strength.

40:30 even the youth shall faint and be weary, and the young men
shal utterli fall: 40:31 but they that wait upon the lord shall renew
their strength; they shall mount up with wing as eagles; they shall
run, and not be weary; and they shall walk, and not faint.

41:1 keep silenc befor me, O islands; and let the peopl renew their
strength: let them come near; then let them speak: let us come near
togeth to judgment.

41:2 who rais up the righteou man from the east, call him to his
foot, gave the nation befor him, and made him rule over kings? he
gav them as the dust to hi sword, and as driven stubbl to hi bow.

41:3 He pursu them, and pass safely; even by the way that he had
not gone with hi feet.

41:4 who hath wrought and done it, call the gener from the
beginning? I the lord, the first, and with the last; I am he.

41:5 the isl saw it, and feared; the end of the earth were afraid,
drew near, and came.

41:6 they help everi one hi neighbour; and everi one said to his
brother, Be of good courage.

41:7 So the carpent encourag the goldsmith, and he that smootheth
with the hammer him that smote the anvil, saying, It is readi for the
sodering: and he fasten it with nails, that it should not be moved.

41:8 but thou, israel, art my servant, jacob whom I have chosen, the
se of abraham my friend.

41:9 thou whom I have taken from the end of the earth, and called
the from the chief men thereof, and said unto thee, thou art my
servant; I have chosen thee, and not cast thee away.

41:10 fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy
god: I will strengthen thee; yea, I will help thee; yea, I will uphold
the with the right hand of my righteousness.

41:11 behold, all they that were incens against thee shall be
asham and confounded: they shall be as nothing; and they that strive
with thee shall perish.

41:12 thou shalt seek them, and shalt not find them, even them that
contend with thee: they that war against thee shall be as nothing,
and as a thing of nought.

41:13 for I the lord thi god will hold thi right hand, say unto
thee, fear not; I will help thee.

41:14 fear not, thou worm jacob, and ye men of israel; I will help
thee, saith the lord, and thi redeemer, the holi one of israel.

41:15 behold, I will make thee a new sharp thresh instrument having
teeth: thou shalt thresh the mountains, and beat them small, and shalt
mak the hill as chaff.

41:16 thou shalt fan them, and the wind shall carri them away, and the
whirlwind shall scatter them: and thou shalt rejoic in the lord, and
shalt glori in the holi one of israel.

41:17 when the poor and needi seek water, and there is none, and their
tongu faileth for thirst, I the lord will hear them, I the god of
israel will not forsak them.

41:18 I will open river in high places, and fountain in the midst of
th valleys: I will make the wilder a pool of water, and the dry
land spring of water.

41:19 I will plant in the wilder the cedar, the shittah tree, and
th myrtle, and the oil tree; I will set in the desert the fir tree,
and the pine, and the box tree together: 41:20 that they may see, and
know, and consider, and understand together, that the hand of the lord
hath done this, and the holi one of israel hath creat it.

41:21 produc your cause, saith the lord; bring forth your strong
reasons, saith the king of jacob.

41:22 let them bring them forth, and shew us what shall happen: let
them shew the former things, what they be, that we may consid them,
and know the latter end of them; or declar us thing for to come.

41:23 shew the thing that are to come hereafter, that we may know
that ye are gods: yea, do good, or do evil, that we may be dismayed,
and behold it together.

41:24 behold, ye are of nothing, and your work of nought: an
abomin is he that chooseth you.

41:25 I have rais up one from the north, and he shall come: from the
ris of the sun shall he call upon my name: and he shall come upon
princ as upon morter, and as the potter treadeth clay.

41:26 who hath declar from the beginning, that we may know? and
beforetime, that we may say, He is righteous? yea, there is none that
sheweth, yea, there is none that declareth, yea, there is none that
heareth your words.

41:27 the first shall say to zion, behold, behold them: and I will
giv to jerusalem one that bringeth good tidings.

41:28 for I beheld, and there wa no man; even among them, and there
wa no counsellor, that, when I ask of them, could answer a word.

41:29 behold, they are all vanity; their work are nothing: their
molten imag are wind and confusion.

42:1 behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul
delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth
judg to the gentiles.

42:2 He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor caus hi voic to be heard in
th street.

42:3 A bruis reed shall he not break, and the smoke flax shall he
not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.

42:4 He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment
in the earth: and the isl shall wait for hi law.

42:5 thu saith god the lord, he that creat the heavens, and
stretch them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which
cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the peopl upon it, and
spirit to them that walk therein: 42:6 I the lord have call thee in
righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give
the for a coven of the people, for a light of the gentiles; 42:7
to open the blind eyes, to bring out the prison from the prison,
and them that sit in dark out of the prison house.

42:8 I am the lord: that is my name: and my glori will I not give to
another, neither my prais to graven images.

42:9 behold, the former thing are come to pass, and new thing do i
declare: befor they spring forth I tell you of them.

42:10 sing unto the lord a new song, and hi prais from the end of
th earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the
isles, and the inhabit thereof.

42:11 let the wilder and the citi thereof lift up their voice,
th villag that kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabit of the rock
sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.

42:12 let them give glori unto the lord, and declar hi prais in the
islands.

42:13 the lord shall go forth as a mighti man, he shall stir up
jealousi like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail
against hi enemies.

42:14 I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and
refrain myself: now will I cri like a travail woman; I will
destroy and devour at once.

42:15 I will make wast mountain and hills, and dri up all their
herbs; and I will make the river islands, and I will dri up the
pools.

42:16 and I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will
lead them in path that they have not known: I will make darkness
light befor them, and crook thing straight. these thing will I do
unto them, and not forsak them.

42:17 they shall be turn back, they shall be greatli ashamed, that
trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our
gods.

42:18 hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.

42:19 who is blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messeng that i
sent?  who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the lord's
servant?  42:20 see mani things, but thou observest not; opening
th ears, but he heareth not.

42:21 the lord is well pleas for hi righteousness' sake; he will
magnifi the law, and make it honourable.

42:22 but thi is a peopl rob and spoiled; they are all of them
snar in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a
prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, restore.

42:23 who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear
for the time to come?  42:24 who gave jacob for a spoil, and israel to
th robbers? did not the lord, he against whom we have sinned? for
they would not walk in hi ways, neither were they obedi unto his
law.

42:25 therefor he hath pour upon him the furi of hi anger, and the
strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he
knew not; and it burn him, yet he laid it not to heart.

43:1 but now thu saith the lord that creat thee, O jacob, and he
that form thee, O israel, fear not: for I have redeem thee, I have
cal thee by thi name; thou art mine.

43:2 when thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee; and
through the rivers, they shall not overflow thee: when thou walkest
through the fire, thou shalt not be burned; neither shall the flame
kindl upon thee.

43:3 for I am the lord thi god, the holi one of israel, thi saviour: i
gav egypt for thi ransom, ethiopia and seba for thee.

43:4 sinc thou wast preciou in my sight, thou hast been honourable,
and I have love thee: therefor will I give men for thee, and people
for thi life.

43:5 fear not: for I am with thee: I will bring thi seed from the
east, and gather thee from the west; 43:6 I will say to the north,
giv up; and to the south, keep not back: bring my son from far, and
mi daughter from the end of the earth; 43:7 even everi one that is
cal by my name: for I have creat him for my glory, I have formed
him; yea, I have made him.

43:8 bring forth the blind peopl that have eyes, and the deaf that
hav ears.

43:9 let all the nation be gather together, and let the peopl be
assembled: who among them can declar this, and shew us former things?
let them bring forth their witnesses, that they may be justified: or
let them hear, and say, It is truth.

43:10 Ye are my witnesses, saith the lord, and my servant whom I have
chosen: that ye may know and believ me, and understand that I am he:
befor me there wa no god formed, neither shall there be after me.

43:11 I, even I, am the lord; and besid me there is no saviour.

43:12 I have declared, and have saved, and I have shewed, when there
wa no strang god among you: therefor ye are my witnesses, saith the
lord, that I am god.

43:13 yea, befor the day wa I am he; and there is none that can
deliv out of my hand: I will work, and who shall let it?  43:14 thus
saith the lord, your redeemer, the holi one of israel; for your sake i
hav sent to babylon, and have brought down all their nobles, and the
chaldeans, whose cri is in the ships.

43:15 I am the lord, your holi one, the creator of israel, your king.

43:16 thu saith the lord, which maketh a way in the sea, and a path
in the mighti waters; 43:17 which bringeth forth the chariot and
horse, the armi and the power; they shall lie down together, they
shal not rise: they are extinct, they are quench as tow.

43:18 rememb ye not the former things, neither consid the things
of old.

43:19 behold, I will do a new thing; now it shall spring forth; shall
y not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness, and rivers
in the desert.

43:20 the beast of the field shall honour me, the dragon and the
owls: becaus I give water in the wilderness, and river in the
desert, to give drink to my people, my chosen.

43:21 thi peopl have I form for myself; they shall shew forth my
praise.

43:22 but thou hast not call upon me, O jacob; but thou hast been
weari of me, O israel.

43:23 thou hast not brought me the small cattl of thi burnt
offerings; neither hast thou honour me with thi sacrifices. I have
not caus thee to serv with an offering, nor weari thee with
incense.

43:24 thou hast bought me no sweet cane with money, neither hast thou
fil me with the fat of thi sacrifices: but thou hast made me to
serv with thi sins, thou hast weari me with thine iniquities.

43:25 I, even I, am he that blotteth out thi transgress for mine
own sake, and will not rememb thi sins.

43:26 put me in remembrance: let us plead together: declar thou, that
thou mayest be justified.

43:27 thi first father hath sinned, and thi teacher have transgressed
against me.

43:28 therefor I have profan the princ of the sanctuary, and have
given jacob to the curse, and israel to reproaches.

44:1 yet now hear, O jacob my servant; and israel, whom I have chosen:
44:2 thu saith the lord that made thee, and form thee from the
womb, which will help thee; fear not, O jacob, my servant; and thou,
jesurun, whom I have chosen.

44:3 for I will pour water upon him that is thirsty, and flood upon
th dri ground: I will pour my spirit upon thi seed, and my blessing
upon thine offspring: 44:4 and they shall spring up as among the
grass, as willow by the water courses.

44:5 one shall say, I am the lord's; and anoth shall call himself by
th name of jacob; and anoth shall subscrib with hi hand unto the
lord, and surnam himself by the name of israel.

44:6 thu saith the lord the king of israel, and hi redeem the lord
of hosts; I am the first, and I am the last; and besid me there is no
god.

44:7 and who, as I, shall call, and shall declar it, and set it in
ord for me, sinc I appoint the ancient people? and the things
that are coming, and shall come, let them shew unto them.

44:8 fear ye not, neither be afraid: have not I told thee from that
time, and have declar it? ye are even my witnesses. Is there a god
besid me? yea, there is no god; I know not any.

44:9 they that make a graven imag are all of them vanity; and their
delect thing shall not profit; and they are their own witnesses;
they see not, nor know; that they may be ashamed.

44:10 who hath form a god, or molten a graven imag that is
profit for nothing?  44:11 behold, all hi fellow shall be
ashamed: and the workmen, they are of men: let them all be gathered
together, let them stand up; yet they shall fear, and they shall be
asham together.

44:12 the smith with the tong both worketh in the coals, and
fashioneth it with hammers, and worketh it with the strength of his
arms: yea, he is hungry, and hi strength faileth: he drinketh no
water, and is faint.

44:13 the carpent stretcheth out hi rule; he marketh it out with a
line; he fitteth it with planes, and he marketh it out with the
compass, and maketh it after the figur of a man, accord to the
beauti of a man; that it may remain in the house.

44:14 He heweth him down cedars, and taketh the cypress and the oak,
which he strengtheneth for himself among the tree of the forest: he
planteth an ash, and the rain doth nourish it.

44:15 then shall it be for a man to burn: for he will take thereof,
and warm himself; yea, he kindleth it, and baketh bread; yea, he
maketh a god, and worshippeth it; he maketh it a graven image, and
falleth down thereto.

44:16 He burneth part thereof in the fire; with part thereof he eateth
flesh; he roasteth roast, and is satisfied: yea, he warmeth himself,
and saith, aha, I am warm, I have seen the fire: 44:17 and the residue
thereof he maketh a god, even hi graven image: he falleth down unto
it, and worshippeth it, and prayeth unto it, and saith, deliv me;
for thou art my god.

44:18 they have not known nor understood: for he hath shut their eyes,
that they cannot see; and their hearts, that they cannot understand.

44:19 and none considereth in hi heart, neither is there knowledge
nor understand to say, I have burn part of it in the fire; yea,
also I have bake bread upon the coal thereof; I have roast flesh,
and eaten it: and shall I make the residu thereof an abomination?
shal I fall down to the stock of a tree?  44:20 He feedeth on ashes:
a deceiv heart hath turn him aside, that he cannot deliv his
soul, nor say, Is there not a lie in my right hand?  44:21 remember
these, O jacob and israel; for thou art my servant: I have formed
thee; thou art my servant: O israel, thou shalt not be forgotten of
me.

44:22 I have blot out, as a thick cloud, thi transgressions, and,
a a cloud, thi sins: return unto me; for I have redeem thee.

44:23 sing, O ye heavens; for the lord hath done it: shout, ye lower
part of the earth: break forth into singing, ye mountains, O forest,
and everi tree therein: for the lord hath redeem jacob, and
glorifi himself in israel.

44:24 thu saith the lord, thi redeemer, and he that form thee from
th womb, I am the lord that maketh all things; that stretcheth forth
th heaven alone; that spreadeth abroad the earth by myself; 44:25
that frustrateth the token of the liars, and maketh divin mad;
that turneth wise men backward, and maketh their knowledg foolish;
44:26 that confirmeth the word of hi servant, and performeth the
counsel of hi messengers; that saith to jerusalem, thou shalt be
inhabited; and to the citi of judah, Ye shall be built, and I will
rais up the decay place thereof: 44:27 that saith to the deep, be
dry, and I will dri up thi rivers: 44:28 that saith of cyrus, He is my
shepherd, and shall perform all my pleasure: even say to jerusalem,
th shalt be built; and to the temple, thi foundat shall be laid.

45:1 thu saith the lord to hi anointed, to cyrus, whose right hand i
hav holden, to subdu nation befor him; and I will loos the loins
of kings, to open befor him the two leav gates; and the gate shall
not be shut; 45:2 I will go befor thee, and make the crook places
straight: I will break in piec the gate of brass, and cut in sunder
th bar of iron: 45:3 and I will give thee the treasur of darkness,
and hidden rich of secret places, that thou mayest know that I, the
lord, which call thee by thi name, am the god of israel.

45:4 for jacob my servant' sake, and israel mine elect, I have even
cal thee by thi name: I have surnam thee, though thou hast not
known me.

45:5 I am the lord, and there is none else, there is no god besid me:
i gird thee, though thou hast not known me: 45:6 that they may know
from the rise of the sun, and from the west, that there is none
besid me. I am the lord, and there is none else.

45:7 I form the light, and creat darkness: I make peace, and create
evil: I the lord do all these things.

45:8 drop down, ye heavens, from above, and let the sky pour down
righteousness: let the earth open, and let them bring forth salvation,
and let righteous spring up together; I the lord have creat it.

45:9 woe unto him that striveth with hi maker! let the potsherd
str with the potsherd of the earth. shall the clay say to him that
fashioneth it, what makest thou? or thi work, He hath no hands?  45:10
woe unto him that saith unto hi father, what begettest thou? or to
th woman, what hast thou brought forth?  45:11 thu saith the lord,
th holi one of israel, and hi maker, ask me of thing to come
concern my sons, and concern the work of my hand command ye me.

45:12 I have made the earth, and creat man upon it: I, even my
hands, have stretch out the heavens, and all their host have i
commanded.

45:13 I have rais him up in righteousness, and I will direct all his
ways: he shall build my city, and he shall let go my captives, not for
pric nor reward, saith the lord of hosts.

45:14 thu saith the lord, the labour of egypt, and merchandis of
ethiopia and of the sabeans, men of stature, shall come over unto
thee, and they shall be thine: they shall come after thee; in chains
they shall come over, and they shall fall down unto thee, they shall
mak supplic unto thee, saying, sure god is in thee; and there
i none else, there is no god.

45:15 verili thou art a god that hidest thyself, O god of israel, the
saviour.

45:16 they shall be ashamed, and also confounded, all of them: they
shal go to confus togeth that are maker of idols.

45:17 but israel shall be save in the lord with an everlasting
salvation: ye shall not be asham nor confound world without end.

45:18 for thu saith the lord that creat the heavens; god himself
that form the earth and made it; he hath establish it, he created
it not in vain, he form it to be inhabited: I am the lord; and there
i none else.

45:19 I have not spoken in secret, in a dark place of the earth: i
said not unto the seed of jacob, seek ye me in vain: I the lord speak
righteousness, I declar thing that are right.

45:20 assembl yourselv and come; draw near together, ye that are
escap of the nations: they have no knowledg that set up the wood of
their graven image, and pray unto a god that cannot save.

45:21 tell ye, and bring them near; yea, let them take counsel
together: who hath declar thi from ancient time? who hath told it
from that time?  have not I the lord? and there is no god els beside
me; a just god and a saviour; there is none besid me.

45:22 look unto me, and be ye saved, all the end of the earth: for i
am god, and there is none else.

45:23 I have sworn by myself, the word is gone out of my mouth in
righteousness, and shall not return, that unto me everi knee shall
bow, everi tongu shall swear.

45:24 surely, shall one say, in the lord have I righteous and
strength: even to him shall men come; and all that are incensed
against him shall be ashamed.

45:25 In the lord shall all the seed of israel be justified, and shall
glory.

46:1 bel boweth down, nebo stoopeth, their idol were upon the beasts,
and upon the cattle: your carriag were heavi loaden; they are a
burden to the weari beast.

46:2 they stoop, they bow down together; they could not deliv the
burden, but themselv are gone into captivity.

46:3 hearken unto me, O hous of jacob, and all the remnant of the
hous of israel, which are born by me from the belly, which are
carri from the womb: 46:4 and even to your old age I am he; and even
to hoar hair will I carri you: I have made, and I will bear; even i
wil carry, and will deliv you.

46:5 To whom will ye liken me, and make me equal, and compar me, that
w may be like?  46:6 they lavish gold out of the bag, and weigh
silv in the balance, and hire a goldsmith; and he maketh it a god:
they fall down, yea, they worship.

46:7 they bear him upon the shoulder, they carri him, and set him in
hi place, and he standeth; from hi place shall he not remove: yea,
on shall cri unto him, yet can he not answer, nor save him out of his
trouble.

46:8 rememb this, and shew yourselv men: bring it again to mind, o
y transgressors.

46:9 rememb the former thing of old: for I am god, and there is
non else; I am god, and there is none like me, 46:10 declar the
end from the beginning, and from ancient time the thing that are not
yet done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my
pleasure: 46:11 call a raven bird from the east, the man that
executeth my counsel from a far country: yea, I have spoken it, I will
also bring it to pass; I have purpos it, I will also do it.

46:12 hearken unto me, ye stouthearted, that are far from
righteousness: 46:13 I bring near my righteousness; it shall not be
far off, and my salvat shall not tarry: and I will place salvation
in zion for israel my glory.

47:1 come down, and sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of babylon, sit
on the ground: there is no throne, O daughter of the chaldeans: for
thou shalt no more be call tender and delicate.

47:2 take the millstones, and grind meal: uncov thi locks, make bare
th leg, uncov the thigh, pass over the rivers.

47:3 thi naked shall be uncovered, yea, thi shame shall be seen: i
wil take vengeance, and I will not meet thee as a man.

47:4 As for our redeemer, the lord of host is hi name, the holi one
of israel.

47:5 sit thou silent, and get thee into darkness, O daughter of the
chaldeans: for thou shalt no more be called, the ladi of kingdoms.

47:6 I wa wroth with my people, I have pollut mine inheritance, and
given them into thine hand: thou didst shew them no mercy; upon the
anci hast thou veri heavili laid thi yoke.

47:7 and thou saidst, I shall be a ladi for ever: so that thou didst
not lay these thing to thi heart, neither didst rememb the latter
end of it.

47:8 therefor hear now this, thou that art given to pleasures, that
dwellest carelessly, that sayest in thine heart, I am, and none else
besid me; I shall not sit as a widow, neither shall I know the loss
of children: 47:9 but these two thing shall come to thee in a moment
in one day, the loss of children, and widowhood: they shall come upon
the in their perfect for the multitud of thi sorceries, and for
th great abund of thine enchantments.

47:10 for thou hast trust in thi wickedness: thou hast said, none
seeth me. thi wisdom and thi knowledge, it hath pervert thee; and
thou hast said in thine heart, I am, and none els besid me.

47:11 therefor shall evil come upon thee; thou shalt not know from
whenc it riseth: and mischief shall fall upon thee; thou shalt not be
abl to put it off: and desol shall come upon thee suddenly,
which thou shalt not know.

47:12 stand now with thine enchantments, and with the multitud of thy
sorceries, wherein thou hast labour from thi youth; if so be thou
shalt be abl to profit, if so be thou mayest prevail.

47:13 thou art weari in the multitud of thi counsels. let now the
astrologers, the stargazers, the monthli prognosticators, stand up,
and save thee from these thing that shall come upon thee.

47:14 behold, they shall be as stubble; the fire shall burn them; they
shal not deliv themselv from the power of the flame: there shall
not be a coal to warm at, nor fire to sit befor it.

47:15 thu shall they be unto thee with whom thou hast laboured, even
thi merchants, from thi youth: they shall wander everi one to his
quarter; none shall save thee.

48:1 hear ye this, O hous of jacob, which are call by the name of
israel, and are come forth out of the water of judah, which swear by
th name of the lord, and make mention of the god of israel, but not
in truth, nor in righteousness.

48:2 for they call themselv of the holi city, and stay themselves
upon the god of israel; the lord of host is hi name.

48:3 I have declar the former thing from the beginning; and they
went forth out of my mouth, and I shew them; I did them suddenly,
and they came to pass.

48:4 becaus I knew that thou art obstinate, and thi neck is an iron
sinew, and thi brow brass; 48:5 I have even from the beginning
declar it to thee; befor it came to pass I shew it thee: lest
thou shouldest say, mine idol hath done them, and my graven image, and
mi molten image, hath command them.

48:6 thou hast heard, see all this; and will not ye declar it? I have
shew thee new thing from thi time, even hidden things, and thou
didst not know them.

48:7 they are creat now, and not from the beginning; even befor the
day when thou heardest them not; lest thou shouldest say, behold, i
knew them.

48:8 yea, thou heardest not; yea, thou knewest not; yea, from that
tim that thine ear wa not opened: for I knew that thou wouldest deal
veri treacherously, and wast call a transgressor from the womb.

48:9 for my name' sake will I defer mine anger, and for my praise
wil I refrain for thee, that I cut thee not off.

48:10 behold, I have refin thee, but not with silver; I have chosen
the in the furnac of affliction.

48:11 for mine own sake, even for mine own sake, will I do it: for how
should my name be polluted? and I will not give my glori unto another.

48:12 hearken unto me, O jacob and israel, my called; I am he; I am
th first, I also am the last.

48:13 mine hand also hath laid the foundat of the earth, and my
right hand hath span the heavens: when I call unto them, they stand
up together.

48:14 all ye, assembl yourselves, and hear; which among them hath
declar these things? the lord hath love him: he will do his
pleasur on babylon, and hi arm shall be on the chaldeans.

48:15 I, even I, have spoken; yea, I have call him: I have brought
him, and he shall make hi way prosperous.

48:16 come ye near unto me, hear ye this; I have not spoken in secret
from the beginning; from the time that it was, there am I: and now the
lord god, and hi spirit, hath sent me.

48:17 thu saith the lord, thi redeemer, the holi one of israel; I am
th lord thi god which teacheth thee to profit, which leadeth thee by
th way that thou shouldest go.

48:18 O that thou hadst hearken to my commandments! then had thy
peac been as a river, and thi righteous as the wave of the sea:
48:19 thi seed also had been as the sand, and the offspr of thy
bowel like the gravel thereof; hi name should not have been cut off
nor destroy from befor me.

48:20 Go ye forth of babylon, flee ye from the chaldeans, with a voice
of sing declar ye, tell this, utter it even to the end of the
earth; say ye, the lord hath redeem hi servant jacob.

48:21 and they thirst not when he led them through the deserts: he
caus the water to flow out of the rock for them: he clave the rock
also, and the water gush out.

48:22 there is no peace, saith the lord, unto the wicked.

49:1 listen, O isles, unto me; and hearken, ye people, from far; the
lord hath call me from the womb; from the bowel of my mother hath
h made mention of my name.

49:2 and he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of
hi hand hath he hid me, and made me a polish shaft; in hi quiver
hath he hid me; 49:3 and said unto me, thou art my servant, O israel,
in whom I will be glorified.

49:4 then I said, I have labour in vain, I have spent my strength
for nought, and in vain: yet sure my judgment is with the lord, and
mi work with my god.

49:5 and now, saith the lord that form me from the womb to be his
servant, to bring jacob again to him, though israel be not gathered,
yet shall I be gloriou in the eye of the lord, and my god shall be
mi strength.

49:6 and he said, It is a light thing that thou shouldest be my
serv to rais up the tribe of jacob, and to restor the preserved
of israel: I will also give thee for a light to the gentiles, that
thou mayest be my salvat unto the end of the earth.

49:7 thu saith the lord, the redeem of israel, and hi holi one, to
him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nation abhorreth, to a servant
of rulers, king shall see and arise, princ also shall worship,
becaus of the lord that is faithful, and the holi one of israel, and
h shall choos thee.

49:8 thu saith the lord, In an accept time have I heard thee, and
in a day of salvat have I help thee: and I will preserv thee,
and give thee for a coven of the people, to establish the earth, to
caus to inherit the desol heritages; 49:9 that thou mayest say to
th prisoners, Go forth; to them that are in darkness, shew
yourselves. they shall feed in the ways, and their pastur shall be
in all high places.

49:10 they shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun
smit them: for he that hath merci on them shall lead them, even by
th spring of water shall he guid them.

49:11 and I will make all my mountain a way, and my highway shall be
exalted.

49:12 behold, these shall come from far: and, lo, these from the north
and from the west; and these from the land of sinim.

49:13 sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; and break forth into
singing, O mountains: for the lord hath comfort hi people, and will
hav merci upon hi afflicted.

49:14 but zion said, the lord hath forsaken me, and my lord hath
forgotten me.

49:15 can a woman forget her suck child, that she should not have
compass on the son of her womb? yea, they may forget, yet will i
not forget thee.

49:16 behold, I have graven thee upon the palm of my hands; thi walls
ar continu befor me.

49:17 thi children shall make haste; thi destroy and they that made
the wast shall go forth of thee.

49:18 lift up thine eye round about, and behold: all these gather
themselv together, and come to thee. As I live, saith the lord, thou
shalt sure cloth thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind
them on thee, as a bride doeth.

49:19 for thi wast and thi desol places, and the land of thy
destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the
inhabitants, and they that swallow thee up shall be far away.

49:20 the children which thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the
other, shall say again in thine ears, the place is too strait for me:
giv place to me that I may dwell.

49:21 then shalt thou say in thine heart, who hath begotten me these,
se I have lost my children, and am desolate, a captive, and
remov to and fro? and who hath brought up these? behold, I wa left
alone; these, where had they been?  49:22 thu saith the lord god,
behold, I will lift up mine hand to the gentiles, and set up my
standard to the people: and they shall bring thi son in their arms,
and thi daughter shall be carri upon their shoulders.

49:23 and king shall be thi nurs fathers, and their queen thy
nurs mothers: they shall bow down to thee with their face toward
th earth, and lick up the dust of thi feet; and thou shalt know that
i am the lord: for they shall not be asham that wait for me.

49:24 shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the law captive
delivered?  49:25 but thu saith the lord, even the captiv of the
mighti shall be taken away, and the prey of the terribl shall be
delivered: for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and
i will save thi children.

49:26 and I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and
they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and
al flesh shall know that I the lord am thi saviour and thi redeemer,
th mighti one of jacob.

50:1 thu saith the lord, where is the bill of your mother's
divorcement, whom I have put away? or which of my creditor is it to
whom I have sold you?  behold, for your iniqu have ye sold
yourselves, and for your transgress is your mother put away.

50:2 wherefore, when I came, wa there no man? when I called, was
ther none to answer? Is my hand shorten at all, that it cannot
redeem? or have I no power to deliver? behold, at my rebuk I dri up
th sea, I make the river a wilderness: their fish stinketh, because
ther is no water, and dieth for thirst.

50:3 I cloth the heaven with blackness, and I make sackcloth their
covering.

50:4 the lord god hath given me the tongu of the learned, that i
should know how to speak a word in season to him that is weary: he
wakeneth morn by morning, he wakeneth mine ear to hear as the
learned.

50:5 the lord god hath open mine ear, and I wa not rebellious,
neith turn away back.

50:6 I gave my back to the smiters, and my cheek to them that plucked
off the hair: I hid not my face from shame and spitting.

50:7 for the lord god will help me; therefor shall I not be
confounded: therefor have I set my face like a flint, and I know that
i shall not be ashamed.

50:8 He is near that justifieth me; who will contend with me? let us
stand together: who is mine adversary? let him come near to me.

50:9 behold, the lord god will help me; who is he that shall condemn
me?  lo, they all shall wax old as a garment; the moth shall eat them
up.

50:10 who is among you that feareth the lord, that obeyeth the voice
of hi servant, that walketh in darkness, and hath no light? let him
trust in the name of the lord, and stay upon hi god.

50:11 behold, all ye that kindl a fire, that compass yourselv about
with sparks: walk in the light of your fire, and in the spark that ye
hav kindled. thi shall ye have of mine hand; ye shall lie down in
sorrow.

51:1 hearken to me, ye that follow after righteousness, ye that seek
th lord: look unto the rock whenc ye are hewn, and to the hole of
th pit whenc ye are digged.

51:2 look unto abraham your father, and unto sarah that bare you: for
i call him alone, and bless him, and increas him.

51:3 for the lord shall comfort zion: he will comfort all her waste
places; and he will make her wilder like eden, and her desert like
th garden of the lord; joy and glad shall be found therein,
thanksgiving, and the voic of melody.

51:4 hearken unto me, my people; and give ear unto me, O my nation:
for a law shall proceed from me, and I will make my judgment to rest
for a light of the people.

51:5 My righteous is near; my salvat is gone forth, and mine
arm shall judg the people; the isl shall wait upon me, and on mine
arm shall they trust.

51:6 lift up your eye to the heavens, and look upon the earth
beneath: for the heaven shall vanish away like smoke, and the earth
shal wax old like a garment, and they that dwell therein shall die in
lik manner: but my salvat shall be for ever, and my righteousness
shal not be abolished.

51:7 hearken unto me, ye that know righteousness, the peopl in whose
heart is my law; fear ye not the reproach of men, neither be ye afraid
of their revilings.

51:8 for the moth shall eat them up like a garment, and the worm shall
eat them like wool: but my righteous shall be for ever, and my
salv from gener to generation.

51:9 awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the lord; awake, as in
th ancient days, in the gener of old. art thou not it that hath
cut rahab, and wound the dragon?  51:10 art thou not it which hath
dri the sea, the water of the great deep; that hath made the depths
of the sea a way for the ransom to pass over?  51:11 therefor the
redeem of the lord shall return, and come with sing unto zion;
and everlast joy shall be upon their head: they shall obtain
glad and joy; and sorrow and mourn shall flee away.

51:12 I, even I, am he that comforteth you: who art thou, that thou
shouldest be afraid of a man that shall die, and of the son of man
which shall be made as grass; 51:13 and forgettest the lord thi maker,
that hath stretch forth the heavens, and laid the foundat of the
earth; and hast fear continu everi day becaus of the furi of
th oppressor, as if he were readi to destroy? and where is the fury
of the oppressor?  51:14 the captiv exil hasteneth that he may be
loosed, and that he should not die in the pit, nor that hi bread
should fail.

51:15 but I am the lord thi god, that divid the sea, whose waves
roared: the lord of host is hi name.

51:16 and I have put my word in thi mouth, and I have cover thee in
th shadow of mine hand, that I may plant the heavens, and lay the
found of the earth, and say unto zion, thou art my people.

51:17 awake, awake, stand up, O jerusalem, which hast drunk at the
hand of the lord the cup of hi fury; thou hast drunken the dreg of
th cup of trembling, and wrung them out.

51:18 there is none to guid her among all the son whom she hath
brought forth; neither is there ani that taketh her by the hand of all
th son that she hath brought up.

51:19 these two thing are come unto thee; who shall be sorri for
thee?  desolation, and destruction, and the famine, and the sword: by
whom shall I comfort thee?  51:20 thi son have fainted, they lie at
th head of all the streets, as a wild bull in a net: they are full of
th furi of the lord, the rebuk of thi god.

51:21 therefor hear now this, thou afflicted, and drunken, but not
with wine: 51:22 thu saith thi lord the lord, and thi god that
pleadeth the caus of hi people, behold, I have taken out of thine
hand the cup of trembling, even the dreg of the cup of my fury; thou
shalt no more drink it again: 51:23 but I will put it into the hand of
them that afflict thee; which have said to thi soul, bow down, that we
may go over: and thou hast laid thi bodi as the ground, and as the
street, to them that went over.

52:1 awake, awake; put on thi strength, O zion; put on thi beautiful
garments, O jerusalem, the holi city: for henceforth there shall no
mor come into thee the uncircumcis and the unclean.

52:2 shake thyself from the dust; arise, and sit down, O jerusalem:
loos thyself from the band of thi neck, O captiv daughter of zion.

52:3 for thu saith the lord, Ye have sold yourselv for nought; and
y shall be redeem without money.

52:4 for thu saith the lord god, My peopl went down aforetim into
egypt to sojourn there; and the assyrian oppress them without cause.

52:5 now therefore, what have I here, saith the lord, that my people
i taken away for nought? they that rule over them make them to howl,
saith the lord; and my name continu everi day is blasphemed.

52:6 therefor my peopl shall know my name: therefor they shall know
in that day that I am he that doth speak: behold, it is i.

52:7 how beauti upon the mountain are the feet of him that
bringeth good tidings, that publisheth peace; that bringeth good
tid of good, that publisheth salvation; that saith unto zion, thy
god reigneth!  52:8 thi watchmen shall lift up the voice; with the
voic togeth shall they sing: for they shall see eye to eye, when
th lord shall bring again zion.

52:9 break forth into joy, sing together, ye wast place of
jerusalem: for the lord hath comfort hi people, he hath redeemed
jerusalem.

52:10 the lord hath made bare hi holi arm in the eye of all the
nations; and all the end of the earth shall see the salvat of our
god.

52:11 depart ye, depart ye, go ye out from thence, touch no unclean
thing; go ye out of the midst of her; be ye clean, that bear the
vessel of the lord.

52:12 for ye shall not go out with haste, nor go by flight: for the
lord will go befor you; and the god of israel will be your rereward.

52:13 behold, my servant shall deal prudently, he shall be exalt and
extolled, and be veri high.

52:14 As mani were astoni at thee; hi visag wa so mar more
than ani man, and hi form more than the son of men: 52:15 So shall
h sprinkl mani nations; the king shall shut their mouth at him:
for that which had not been told them shall they see; and that which
they had not heard shall they consider.

53:1 who hath believ our report? and to whom is the arm of the lord
revealed?  53:2 for he shall grow up befor him as a tender plant, and
a a root out of a dri ground: he hath no form nor comeliness; and
when we shall see him, there is no beauti that we should desir him.

53:3 He is despis and reject of men; a man of sorrows, and
acquaint with grief: and we hid as it were our face from him; he
wa despised, and we esteem him not.

53:4 sure he hath born our griefs, and carri our sorrows: yet we
did esteem him stricken, smitten of god, and afflicted.

53:5 but he wa wound for our transgressions, he wa bruis for our
iniquities: the chastis of our peac wa upon him; and with his
strip we are healed.

53:6 all we like sheep have gone astray; we have turn everi one to
hi own way; and the lord hath laid on him the iniqu of us all.

53:7 He wa oppressed, and he wa afflicted, yet he open not his
mouth: he is brought as a lamb to the slaughter, and as a sheep before
h shearer is dumb, so he openeth not hi mouth.

53:8 He wa taken from prison and from judgment: and who shall declare
hi generation? for he wa cut off out of the land of the living: for
th transgress of my peopl wa he stricken.

53:9 and he made hi grave with the wicked, and with the rich in his
death; becaus he had done no violence, neither wa ani deceit in his
mouth.

53:10 yet it pleas the lord to bruis him; he hath put him to grief:
when thou shalt make hi soul an offer for sin, he shall see his
seed, he shall prolong hi days, and the pleasur of the lord shall
prosp in hi hand.

53:11 He shall see of the travail of hi soul, and shall be satisfied:
bi hi knowledg shall my righteou servant justifi many; for he shall
bear their iniquities.

53:12 therefor will I divid him a portion with the great, and he
shal divid the spoil with the strong; becaus he hath pour out his
soul unto death: and he wa number with the transgressors; and he
bar the sin of many, and made intercess for the transgressors.

54:1 sing, O barren, thou that didst not bear; break forth into
singing, and cri aloud, thou that didst not travail with child: for
mor are the children of the desol than the children of the married
wife, saith the lord.

54:2 enlarg the place of thi tent, and let them stretch forth the
curtain of thine habitations: spare not, lengthen thi cords, and
strengthen thi stakes; 54:3 for thou shalt break forth on the right
hand and on the left; and thi seed shall inherit the gentiles, and
mak the desol citi to be inhabited.

54:4 fear not; for thou shalt not be ashamed: neither be thou
confounded; for thou shalt not be put to shame: for thou shalt forget
th shame of thi youth, and shalt not rememb the reproach of thy
widowhood ani more.

54:5 for thi maker is thine husband; the lord of host is hi name;
and thi redeem the holi one of israel; the god of the whole earth
shal he be called.

54:6 for the lord hath call thee as a woman forsaken and griev in
spirit, and a wife of youth, when thou wast refused, saith thi god.

54:7 for a small moment have I forsaken thee; but with great mercies
wil I gather thee.

54:8 In a littl wrath I hid my face from thee for a moment; but with
everlast kind will I have merci on thee, saith the lord thy
redeemer.

54:9 for thi is as the water of noah unto me: for as I have sworn
that the water of noah should no more go over the earth; so have i
sworn that I would not be wroth with thee, nor rebuk thee.

54:10 for the mountain shall depart, and the hill be removed; but my
kind shall not depart from thee, neither shall the coven of my
peac be removed, saith the lord that hath merci on thee.

54:11 O thou afflicted, toss with tempest, and not comforted,
behold, I will lay thi stone with fair colours, and lay thy
found with sapphires.

54:12 and I will make thi window of agates, and thi gate of
carbuncles, and all thi border of pleasant stones.

54:13 and all thi children shall be taught of the lord; and great
shal be the peac of thi children.

54:14 In righteous shalt thou be established: thou shalt be far
from oppression; for thou shalt not fear: and from terror; for it
shal not come near thee.

54:15 behold, they shall sure gather together, but not by me:
whosoev shall gather togeth against thee shall fall for thi sake.

54:16 behold, I have creat the smith that bloweth the coal in the
fire, and that bringeth forth an instrument for hi work; and I have
cr the waster to destroy.

54:17 No weapon that is form against thee shall prosper; and every
tongu that shall rise against thee in judgment thou shalt condemn.
thi is the heritag of the servant of the lord, and their
right is of me, saith the lord.

55:1 ho, everi one that thirsteth, come ye to the waters, and he that
hath no money; come ye, buy, and eat; yea, come, buy wine and milk
without money and without price.

55:2 wherefor do ye spend money for that which is not bread? and your
labour for that which satisfieth not? hearken dilig unto me, and
eat ye that which is good, and let your soul delight itself in
fatness.

55:3 inclin your ear, and come unto me: hear, and your soul shall
live; and I will make an everlast coven with you, even the sure
merci of david.

55:4 behold, I have given him for a wit to the people, a leader
and command to the people.

55:5 behold, thou shalt call a nation that thou knowest not, and
nat that knew not thee shall run unto thee becaus of the lord thy
god, and for the holi one of israel; for he hath glorifi thee.

55:6 seek ye the lord while he may be found, call ye upon him while he
i near: 55:7 let the wick forsak hi way, and the unright man
hi thoughts: and let him return unto the lord, and he will have mercy
upon him; and to our god, for he will abundantli pardon.

55:8 for my thought are not your thoughts, neither are your way my
ways, saith the lord.

55:9 for as the heaven are higher than the earth, so are my ways
high than your ways, and my thought than your thoughts.

55:10 for as the rain cometh down, and the snow from heaven, and
returneth not thither, but watereth the earth, and maketh it bring
forth and bud, that it may give seed to the sower, and bread to the
eater: 55:11 So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it
shal not return unto me void, but it shall accomplish that which i
please, and it shall prosper in the thing whereto I sent it.

55:12 for ye shall go out with joy, and be led forth with peace: the
mountain and the hill shall break forth befor you into singing, and
al the tree of the field shall clap their hands.

55:13 instead of the thorn shall come up the fir tree, and instead of
th brier shall come up the myrtl tree: and it shall be to the lord
for a name, for an everlast sign that shall not be cut off.

56:1 thu saith the lord, keep ye judgment, and do justice: for my
salv is near to come, and my righteous to be revealed.

56:2 bless is the man that doeth this, and the son of man that
layeth hold on it; that keepeth the sabbath from pollut it, and
keepeth hi hand from do ani evil.

56:3 neither let the son of the stranger, that hath join himself to
th lord, speak, saying, the lord hath utterli separ me from his
people: neither let the eunuch say, behold, I am a dri tree.

56:4 for thu saith the lord unto the eunuch that keep my sabbaths,
and choos the thing that pleas me, and take hold of my covenant;
56:5 even unto them will I give in mine hous and within my wall a
plac and a name better than of son and of daughters: I will give
them an everlast name, that shall not be cut off.

56:6 also the son of the stranger, that join themselv to the lord,
to serv him, and to love the name of the lord, to be hi servants,
everi one that keepeth the sabbath from pollut it, and taketh hold
of my covenant; 56:7 even them will I bring to my holi mountain, and
mak them joy in my hous of prayer: their burnt offer and
their sacrific shall be accept upon mine altar; for mine house
shal be call an hous of prayer for all people.

56:8 the lord god, which gathereth the outcast of israel saith, yet
wil I gather other to him, besid those that are gather unto him.

56:9 all ye beast of the field, come to devour, yea, all ye beast in
th forest.

56:10 hi watchmen are blind: they are all ignorant, they are all dumb
dogs, they cannot bark; sleeping, lie down, love to slumber.

56:11 yea, they are greedi dog which can never have enough, and they
ar shepherd that cannot understand: they all look to their own way,
everi one for hi gain, from hi quarter.

56:12 come ye, say they, I will fetch wine, and we will fill ourselves
with strong drink; and to morrow shall be as thi day, and much more
abundant.

57:1 the righteou perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and
merci men are taken away, none consid that the righteou is
taken away from the evil to come.

57:2 He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each
on walk in hi uprightness.

57:3 but draw near hither, ye son of the sorceress, the seed of the
adulter and the whore.

57:4 against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide
mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression,
a seed of falsehood.

57:5 enflam yourselv with idol under everi green tree, slaying
th children in the valley under the clift of the rocks?  57:6 among
th smooth stone of the stream is thi portion; they, they are thy
lot: even to them hast thou pour a drink offering, thou hast offered
a meat offering. should I receiv comfort in these?  57:7 upon a lofty
and high mountain hast thou set thi bed: even thither wentest thou up
to offer sacrifice.

57:8 behind the door also and the post hast thou set up thy
remembrance: for thou hast discov thyself to anoth than me, and
art gone up; thou hast enlarg thi bed, and made thee a coven with
them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.

57:9 and thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase
thi perfumes, and didst send thi messeng far off, and didst debase
thyself even unto hell.

57:10 thou art weari in the great of thi way; yet saidst thou
not, there is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand;
therefor thou wast not grieved.

57:11 and of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast
lied, and hast not rememb me, nor laid it to thi heart? have not i
held my peac even of old, and thou fearest me not?  57:12 I will
declar thi righteousness, and thi works; for they shall not profit
thee.

57:13 when thou criest, let thi compani deliv thee; but the wind
shal carri them all away; vaniti shall take them: but he that putteth
hi trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy
mountain; 57:14 and shall say, cast ye up, cast ye up, prepar the
way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.

57:15 for thu saith the high and lofti one that inhabiteth eternity,
whos name is holy; I dwell in the high and holi place, with him also
that is of a contrit and humbl spirit, to reviv the spirit of the
humble, and to reviv the heart of the contrit ones.

57:16 for I will not contend for ever, neither will I be alway wroth:
for the spirit should fail befor me, and the soul which I have made.

57:17 for the iniqu of hi covet wa I wroth, and smote him:
i hid me, and wa wroth, and he went on frowardli in the way of his
heart.

57:18 I have seen hi ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also,
and restor comfort unto him and to hi mourners.

57:19 I creat the fruit of the lips; peace, peac to him that is far
off, and to him that is near, saith the lord; and I will heal him.

57:20 but the wick are like the troubl sea, when it cannot rest,
whos water cast up mire and dirt.

57:21 there is no peace, saith my god, to the wicked.

58:1 cri aloud, spare not, lift up thi voic like a trumpet, and shew
mi peopl their transgression, and the hous of jacob their sins.

58:2 yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways, as a nation
that did righteousness, and forsook not the ordin of their god:
they ask of me the ordin of justice; they take delight in
approach to god.

58:3 wherefor have we fasted, say they, and thou seest not? wherefore
hav we afflict our soul, and thou takest no knowledge? behold, in
th day of your fast ye find pleasure, and exact all your labours.

58:4 behold, ye fast for strife and debate, and to smite with the fist
of wickedness: ye shall not fast as ye do thi day, to make your voice
to be heard on high.

58:5 Is it such a fast that I have chosen? a day for a man to afflict
hi soul? is it to bow down hi head as a bulrush, and to spread
sackcloth and ash under him? wilt thou call thi a fast, and an
accept day to the lord?  58:6 Is not thi the fast that I have
chosen? to loos the band of wickedness, to undo the heavi burdens,
and to let the oppress go free, and that ye break everi yoke?  58:7
i it not to deal thi bread to the hungry, and that thou bring the
poor that are cast out to thi house? when thou seest the naked, that
thou cover him; and that thou hide not thyself from thine own flesh?
58:8 then shall thi light break forth as the morning, and thine health
shal spring forth speedily: and thi righteous shall go before
thee; the glori of the lord shall be thi rereward.

58:9 then shalt thou call, and the lord shall answer; thou shalt cry,
and he shall say, here I am. If thou take away from the midst of thee
th yoke, the put forth of the finger, and speak vanity; 58:10
and if thou draw out thi soul to the hungry, and satisfi the afflicted
soul; then shall thi light rise in obscurity, and thi dark be as
th noon day: 58:11 and the lord shall guid thee continually, and
satisfi thi soul in drought, and make fat thi bones: and thou shalt be
lik a water garden, and like a spring of water, whose water fail
not.

58:12 and they that shall be of thee shall build the old wast places:
th shalt rais up the foundat of mani generations; and thou
shalt be called, the repair of the breach, the restor of path to
dwel in.

58:13 If thou turn away thi foot from the sabbath, from do thy
pleasur on my holi day; and call the sabbath a delight, the holi of
th lord, honourable; and shalt honour him, not do thine own ways,
nor find thine own pleasure, nor speak thine own words: 58:14
then shalt thou delight thyself in the lord; and I will caus thee to
rid upon the high place of the earth, and feed thee with the
heritag of jacob thi father: for the mouth of the lord hath spoken
it.

59:1 behold, the lord' hand is not shortened, that it cannot save;
neith hi ear heavy, that it cannot hear: 59:2 but your iniquities
hav separ between you and your god, and your sin have hid his
fac from you, that he will not hear.

59:3 for your hand are defil with blood, and your finger with
iniquity; your lip have spoken lies, your tongu hath muttered
perverseness.

59:4 none calleth for justice, nor ani pleadeth for truth: they trust
in vanity, and speak lies; they conceiv mischief, and bring forth
iniquity.

59:5 they hatch cockatrice' eggs, and weav the spider' web: he that
eateth of their egg dieth, and that which is crush breaketh out
into a viper.

59:6 their web shall not becom garments, neither shall they cover
themselv with their works: their work are work of iniquity, and
th act of violenc is in their hands.

59:7 their feet run to evil, and they make hast to shed innocent
blood: their thought are thought of iniquity; wast and
destruct are in their paths.

59:8 the way of peac they know not; and there is no judgment in their
goings: they have made them crook paths: whosoev goeth therein
shal not know peace.

59:9 therefor is judgment far from us, neither doth justic overtake
us: we wait for light, but behold obscurity; for brightness, but we
walk in darkness.

59:10 We grope for the wall like the blind, and we grope as if we had
no eyes: we stumbl at noon day as in the night; we are in desolate
plac as dead men.

59:11 We roar all like bears, and mourn sore like doves: we look for
judgment, but there is none; for salvation, but it is far off from us.

59:12 for our transgress are multipli befor thee, and our sins
testifi against us: for our transgress are with us; and as for our
iniquities, we know them; 59:13 In transgress and lie against the
lord, and depart away from our god, speak oppress and revolt,
conceiv and utter from the heart word of falsehood.

59:14 and judgment is turn away backward, and justic standeth afar
off: for truth is fallen in the street, and equiti cannot enter.

59:15 yea, truth faileth; and he that departeth from evil maketh
himself a prey: and the lord saw it, and it displeas him that there
wa no judgment.

59:16 and he saw that there wa no man, and wonder that there wa no
intercessor: therefor hi arm brought salvat unto him; and his
righteousness, it sustain him.

59:17 for he put on righteous as a breastplate, and an helmet of
salv upon hi head; and he put on the garment of vengeanc for
clothing, and wa clad with zeal as a cloak.

59:18 accord to their deeds, accordingli he will repay, furi to his
adversaries, recomp to hi enemies; to the island he will repay
recompence.

59:19 So shall they fear the name of the lord from the west, and his
glori from the rise of the sun. when the enemi shall come in like a
flood, the spirit of the lord shall lift up a standard against him.

59:20 and the redeem shall come to zion, and unto them that turn
from transgress in jacob, saith the lord.

59:21 As for me, thi is my coven with them, saith the lord; my
spirit that is upon thee, and my word which I have put in thi mouth,
shal not depart out of thi mouth, nor out of the mouth of thi seed,
nor out of the mouth of thi seed' seed, saith the lord, from
henceforth and for ever.

60:1 arise, shine; for thi light is come, and the glori of the lord is
risen upon thee.

60:2 for, behold, the dark shall cover the earth, and gross
dark the people: but the lord shall aris upon thee, and hi glory
shal be seen upon thee.

60:3 and the gentil shall come to thi light, and king to the
bright of thi rising.

60:4 lift up thine eye round about, and see: all they gather
themselv together, they come to thee: thi son shall come from far,
and thi daughter shall be nurs at thi side.

60:5 then thou shalt see, and flow together, and thine heart shall
fear, and be enlarged; becaus the abund of the sea shall be
convert unto thee, the forc of the gentil shall come unto thee.

60:6 the multitud of camel shall cover thee, the dromedari of
midian and ephah; all they from sheba shall come: they shall bring
gold and incense; and they shall shew forth the prais of the lord.

60:7 all the flock of kedar shall be gather togeth unto thee, the
ram of nebaioth shall minist unto thee: they shall come up with
accept on mine altar, and I will glorifi the hous of my glory.

60:8 who are these that fli as a cloud, and as the dove to their
windows?  60:9 sure the isl shall wait for me, and the ship of
tarshish first, to bring thi son from far, their silver and their
gold with them, unto the name of the lord thi god, and to the holi one
of israel, becaus he hath glorifi thee.

60:10 and the son of stranger shall build up thi walls, and their
k shall minist unto thee: for in my wrath I smote thee, but in
mi favour have I had merci on thee.

60:11 therefor thi gate shall be open continually; they shall not be
shut day nor night; that men may bring unto thee the forc of the
gentiles, and that their king may be brought.

60:12 for the nation and kingdom that will not serv thee shall
perish; yea, those nation shall be utterli wasted.

60:13 the glori of lebanon shall come unto thee, the fir tree, the
pin tree, and the box together, to beautifi the place of my
sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.

60:14 the son also of them that afflict thee shall come bending
unto thee; and all they that despis thee shall bow themselv down
at the sole of thi feet; and they shall call thee; the citi of the
lord, the zion of the holi one of israel.

60:15 wherea thou ha been forsaken and hated, so that no man went
through thee, I will make thee an etern excellency, a joy of many
generations.

60:16 thou shalt also suck the milk of the gentiles, and shalt suck
th breast of kings: and thou shalt know that I the lord am thy
saviour and thi redeemer, the mighti one of jacob.

60:17 for brass I will bring gold, and for iron I will bring silver,
and for wood brass, and for stone iron: I will also make thi officers
peace, and thine exactor righteousness.

60:18 violenc shall no more be heard in thi land, wast nor
destruct within thi borders; but thou shalt call thi walls
salvation, and thi gate praise.

60:19 the sun shall be no more thi light by day; neither for
bright shall the moon give light unto thee: but the lord shall be
unto thee an everlast light, and thi god thi glory.

60:20 thi sun shall no more go down; neither shall thi moon withdraw
itself: for the lord shall be thine everlast light, and the day of
thi mourn shall be ended.

60:21 thi peopl also shall be all righteous: they shall inherit the
land for ever, the branch of my planting, the work of my hands, that i
may be glorified.

60:22 A littl one shall becom a thousand, and a small one a strong
nation: I the lord will hasten it in hi time.

61:1 the spirit of the lord god is upon me; becaus the lord hath
anoint me to preach good tide unto the meek; he hath sent me to
bind up the brokenhearted, to proclaim liberti to the captives, and
th open of the prison to them that are bound; 61:2 To proclaim the
accept year of the lord, and the day of vengeanc of our god; to
comfort all that mourn; 61:3 To appoint unto them that mourn in zion,
to give unto them beauti for ashes, the oil of joy for mourning, the
gar of prais for the spirit of heaviness; that they might be
cal tree of righteousness, the plant of the lord, that he might
b glorified.

61:4 and they shall build the old wastes, they shall rais up the
form desolations, and they shall repair the wast cities, the
desol of mani generations.

61:5 and stranger shall stand and feed your flocks, and the son of
th alien shall be your plowmen and your vinedressers.

61:6 but ye shall be name the priest of the lord: men shall call you
th minist of our god: ye shall eat the rich of the gentiles, and
in their glori shall ye boast yourselves.

61:7 for your shame ye shall have double; and for confus they shall
rejoic in their portion: therefor in their land they shall possess
th double: everlast joy shall be unto them.

61:8 for I the lord love judgment, I hate robberi for burnt offering;
and I will direct their work in truth, and I will make an everlasting
coven with them.

61:9 and their seed shall be known among the gentiles, and their
offspr among the people: all that see them shall acknowledg them,
that they are the seed which the lord hath blessed.

61:10 I will greatli rejoic in the lord, my soul shall be joy in
mi god; for he hath cloth me with the garment of salvation, he hath
cov me with the robe of righteousness, as a bridegroom decketh
himself with ornaments, and as a bride adorneth herself with her
jewels.

61:11 for as the earth bringeth forth her bud, and as the garden
causeth the thing that are sown in it to spring forth; so the lord
god will caus righteous and prais to spring forth befor all the
nations.

62:1 for zion' sake will I not hold my peace, and for jerusalem's
sak I will not rest, until the righteous thereof go forth as
brightness, and the salvat thereof as a lamp that burneth.

62:2 and the gentil shall see thi righteousness, and all king thy
glory: and thou shalt be call by a new name, which the mouth of the
lord shall name.

62:3 thou shalt also be a crown of glori in the hand of the lord, and
a royal diadem in the hand of thi god.

62:4 thou shalt no more be term forsaken; neither shall thi land any
mor be term desolate: but thou shalt be call hephzibah, and thy
land beulah: for the lord delighteth in thee, and thi land shall be
married.

62:5 for as a young man marrieth a virgin, so shall thi son marry
thee: and as the bridegroom rejoiceth over the bride, so shall thi god
rejoic over thee.

62:6 I have set watchmen upon thi walls, O jerusalem, which shall
nev hold their peac day nor night: ye that make mention of the
lord, keep not silence, 62:7 and give him no rest, till he establish,
and till he make jerusalem a prais in the earth.

62:8 the lord hath sworn by hi right hand, and by the arm of his
strength, sure I will no more give thi corn to be meat for thine
enemies; and the son of the stranger shall not drink thi wine, for
th which thou hast laboured: 62:9 but they that have gather it
shal eat it, and prais the lord; and they that have brought it
togeth shall drink it in the court of my holiness.

62:10 Go through, go through the gates; prepar ye the way of the
people; cast up, cast up the highway; gather out the stones; lift up a
standard for the people.

62:11 behold, the lord hath proclaim unto the end of the world, say
y to the daughter of zion, behold, thi salvat cometh; behold, his
reward is with him, and hi work befor him.

62:12 and they shall call them, the holi people, the redeem of the
lord: and thou shalt be called, sought out, A citi not forsaken.

63:1 who is thi that cometh from edom, with dy garment from
bozrah?  thi that is gloriou in hi apparel, travel in the
great of hi strength? I that speak in righteousness, mighti to
save.

63:2 wherefor art thou red in thine apparel, and thi garment like
him that treadeth in the winefat?  63:3 I have trodden the winepress
alone; and of the peopl there wa none with me: for I will tread them
in mine anger, and trampl them in my fury; and their blood shall be
sprinkl upon my garments, and I will stain all my raiment.

63:4 for the day of vengeanc is in mine heart, and the year of my
redeem is come.

63:5 and I looked, and there wa none to help; and I wonder that
ther wa none to uphold: therefor mine own arm brought salvation
unto me; and my fury, it upheld me.

63:6 and I will tread down the peopl in mine anger, and make them
drunk in my fury, and I will bring down their strength to the earth.

63:7 I will mention the lovingkind of the lord, and the praises
of the lord, accord to all that the lord hath bestow on us, and
th great good toward the hous of israel, which he hath bestowed
on them accord to hi mercies, and accord to the multitud of
hi lovingkindnesses.

63:8 for he said, sure they are my people, children that will not
lie: so he wa their saviour.

63:9 In all their afflict he wa afflicted, and the angel of his
pres save them: in hi love and in hi piti he redeem them; and
h bare them, and carri them all the day of old.

63:10 but they rebelled, and vex hi holi spirit: therefor he was
turn to be their enemy, and he fought against them.

63:11 then he rememb the day of old, moses, and hi people,
saying, where is he that brought them up out of the sea with the
shepherd of hi flock? where is he that put hi holi spirit within
him?  63:12 that led them by the right hand of mose with hi glorious
arm, divid the water befor them, to make himself an everlasting
name?  63:13 that led them through the deep, as an hors in the
wilderness, that they should not stumble?  63:14 As a beast goeth down
into the valley, the spirit of the lord caus him to rest: so didst
thou lead thi people, to make thyself a gloriou name.

63:15 look down from heaven, and behold from the habit of thy
holi and of thi glory: where is thi zeal and thi strength, the
sound of thi bowel and of thi merci toward me? are they
restrained?  63:16 doubtless thou art our father, though abraham be
ignor of us, and israel acknowledg us not: thou, O lord, art our
father, our redeemer; thi name is from everlasting.

63:17 O lord, whi hast thou made us to err from thi ways, and hardened
our heart from thi fear? return for thi servants' sake, the tribe of
thin inheritance.

63:18 the peopl of thi holi have possess it but a littl while:
our adversari have trodden down thi sanctuary.

63:19 We are thine: thou never barest rule over them; they were not
cal by thi name.

64:1 Oh that thou wouldest rend the heavens, that thou wouldest come
down, that the mountain might flow down at thi presence, 64:2 As when
th melt fire burneth, the fire causeth the water to boil, to make
thi name known to thine adversaries, that the nation may trembl at
thi presence!  64:3 when thou didst terribl thing which we looked
not for, thou camest down, the mountain flow down at thi presence.

64:4 for sinc the begin of the world men have not heard, nor
perceiv by the ear, neither hath the eye seen, O god, besid thee,
what he hath prepar for him that waiteth for him.

64:5 thou meetest him that rejoiceth and worketh righteousness, those
that rememb thee in thi ways: behold, thou art wroth; for we have
sinned: in those is continuance, and we shall be saved.

64:6 but we are all as an unclean thing, and all our righteousnesses
ar as filthi rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities,
lik the wind, have taken us away.

64:7 and there is none that calleth upon thi name, that stirreth up
himself to take hold of thee: for thou hast hid thi face from us, and
hast consum us, becaus of our iniquities.

64:8 but now, O lord, thou art our father; we are the clay, and thou
our potter; and we all are the work of thi hand.

64:9 Be not wroth veri sore, O lord, neither rememb iniqu for
ever: behold, see, we beseech thee, we are all thi people.

64:10 thi holi citi are a wilderness, zion is a wilderness,
jerusalem a desolation.

64:11 our holi and our beauti house, where our father praised
thee, is burn up with fire: and all our pleasant thing are laid
waste.

64:12 wilt thou refrain thyself for these things, O lord? wilt thou
hold thi peace, and afflict us veri sore?  65:1 I am sought of them
that ask not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said,
behold me, behold me, unto a nation that wa not call by my name.

65:2 I have spread out my hand all the day unto a rebelli people,
which walketh in a way that wa not good, after their own thoughts;
65:3 A peopl that provoketh me to anger continu to my face; that
sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incens upon altar of brick; 65:4
which remain among the graves, and lodg in the monuments, which eat
swine' flesh, and broth of abomin thing is in their vessels;
65:5 which say, stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier
than thou. these are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the
day.

65:6 behold, it is written befor me: I will not keep silence, but
wil recompense, even recompens into their bosom, 65:7 your
iniquities, and the iniqu of your father together, saith the
lord, which have burn incens upon the mountains, and blasphem me
upon the hills: therefor will I measur their former work into their
bosom.

65:8 thu saith the lord, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and
on saith, destroy it not; for a bless is in it: so will I do for
mi servants' sakes, that I may not destroy them all.

65:9 and I will bring forth a seed out of jacob, and out of judah an
inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my
serv shall dwell there.

65:10 and sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of achor a
plac for the herd to lie down in, for my peopl that have sought me.

65:11 but ye are they that forsak the lord, that forget my holy
mountain, that prepar a tabl for that troop, and that furnish the
drink offer unto that number.

65:12 therefor will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow
down to the slaughter: becaus when I called, ye did not answer; when
i spake, ye did not hear; but did evil befor mine eyes, and did
choos that wherein I delight not.

65:13 therefor thu saith the lord god, behold, my servant shall
eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servant shall drink, but ye
shal be thirsty: behold, my servant shall rejoice, but ye shall be
ashamed: 65:14 behold, my servant shall sing for joy of heart, but ye
shal cri for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexat of spirit.

65:15 and ye shall leav your name for a curs unto my chosen: for the
lord god shall slay thee, and call hi servant by anoth name: 65:16
that he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the
god of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the god
of truth; becaus the former troubl are forgotten, and becaus they
ar hid from mine eyes.

65:17 for, behold, I creat new heaven and a new earth: and the
form shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.

65:18 but be ye glad and rejoic for ever in that which I create: for,
behold, I creat jerusalem a rejoicing, and her peopl a joy.

65:19 and I will rejoic in jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the
voic of weep shall be no more heard in her, nor the voic of
crying.

65:20 there shall be no more thenc an infant of days, nor an old man
that hath not fill hi days: for the child shall die an hundred
year old; but the sinner be an hundr year old shall be
accursed.

65:21 and they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall
plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.

65:22 they shall not build, and anoth inhabit; they shall not plant,
and anoth eat: for as the day of a tree are the day of my people,
and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.

65:23 they shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for
they are the seed of the bless of the lord, and their offspr with
them.

65:24 and it shall come to pass, that befor they call, I will answer;
and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.

65:25 the wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall
eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent' meat. they
shal not hurt nor destroy in all my holi mountain, saith the lord.

66:1 thu saith the lord, the heaven is my throne, and the earth is my
footstool: where is the hous that ye build unto me? and where is the
plac of my rest?  66:2 for all those thing hath mine hand made, and
al those thing have been, saith the lord: but to thi man will i
look, even to him that is poor and of a contrit spirit, and trembleth
at my word.

66:3 He that killeth an ox is as if he slew a man; he that sacrificeth
a lamb, as if he cut off a dog' neck; he that offereth an oblation,
a if he offer swine' blood; he that burneth incense, as if he
bless an idol.

yea, they have chosen their own ways, and their soul delighteth in
their abominations.

66:4 I also will choos their delusions, and will bring their fears
upon them; becaus when I called, none did answer; when I spake, they
did not hear: but they did evil befor mine eyes, and chose that in
which I delight not.

66:5 hear the word of the lord, ye that trembl at hi word; your
brethren that hate you, that cast you out for my name' sake, said,
let the lord be glorified: but he shall appear to your joy, and they
shal be ashamed.

66:6 A voic of nois from the city, a voic from the temple, a voice
of the lord that rendereth recomp to hi enemies.

66:7 befor she travailed, she brought forth; befor her pain came,
sh wa deliv of a man child.

66:8 who hath heard such a thing? who hath seen such things? shall the
earth be made to bring forth in one day? or shall a nation be born at
once?  for as soon as zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

66:9 shall I bring to the birth, and not caus to bring forth? saith
th lord: shall I caus to bring forth, and shut the womb? saith thy
god.

66:10 rejoic ye with jerusalem, and be glad with her, all ye that
lov her: rejoic for joy with her, all ye that mourn for her: 66:11
that ye may suck, and be satisfi with the breast of her
consolations; that ye may milk out, and be delight with the
abund of her glory.

66:12 for thu saith the lord, behold, I will extend peac to her like
a river, and the glori of the gentil like a flow stream: then
shal ye suck, ye shall be born upon her sides, and be dandl upon
h knees.

66:13 As one whom hi mother comforteth, so will I comfort you; and ye
shal be comfort in jerusalem.

66:14 and when ye see this, your heart shall rejoice, and your bones
shal flourish like an herb: and the hand of the lord shall be known
toward hi servants, and hi indign toward hi enemies.

66:15 for, behold, the lord will come with fire, and with hi chariots
lik a whirlwind, to render hi anger with fury, and hi rebuk with
flam of fire.

66:16 for by fire and by hi sword will the lord plead with all flesh:
and the slain of the lord shall be many.

66:17 they that sanctifi themselves, and purifi themselv in the
garden behind one tree in the midst, eat swine' flesh, and the
abomination, and the mouse, shall be consum together, saith the
lord.

66:18 for I know their work and their thoughts: it shall come, that i
wil gather all nation and tongues; and they shall come, and see my
glory.

66:19 and I will set a sign among them, and I will send those that
escap of them unto the nations, to tarshish, pul, and lud, that draw
th bow, to tubal, and javan, to the isl afar off, that have not
heard my fame, neither have seen my glory; and they shall declar my
glori among the gentiles.

66:20 and they shall bring all your brethren for an offer unto the
lord out of all nation upon horses, and in chariots, and in litters,
and upon mules, and upon swift beasts, to my holi mountain jerusalem,
saith the lord, as the children of israel bring an offer in a clean
vessel into the hous of the lord.

66:21 and I will also take of them for priest and for levites, saith
th lord.

66:22 for as the new heaven and the new earth, which I will make,
shal remain befor me, saith the lord, so shall your seed and your
nam remain.

66:23 and it shall come to pass, that from one new moon to another,
and from one sabbath to another, shall all flesh come to worship
befor me, saith the lord.

66:24 and they shall go forth, and look upon the carcas of the men
that have transgress against me: for their worm shall not die,
neith shall their fire be quenched; and they shall be an abhorring
unto all flesh.




th book of the prophet jeremiah


1:1 the word of jeremiah the son of hilkiah, of the priest that
wer in anathoth in the land of benjamin: 1:2 To whom the word of the
lord came in the day of josiah the son of amon king of judah, in the
thirteenth year of hi reign.

1:3 It came also in the day of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of
judah, unto the end of the eleventh year of zedekiah the son of josiah
k of judah, unto the carri away of jerusalem captiv in the
fifth month.

1:4 then the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 1:5 befor i
form thee in the belli I knew thee; and befor thou camest forth out
of the womb I sanctifi thee, and I ordain thee a prophet unto the
nations.

1:6 then said I, ah, lord god! behold, I cannot speak: for I am a
child.

1:7 but the lord said unto me, say not, I am a child: for thou shalt
go to all that I shall send thee, and whatsoev I command thee thou
shalt speak.

1:8 Be not afraid of their faces: for I am with thee to deliv thee,
