saith the lord.

1:9 then the lord put forth hi hand, and touch my mouth. and the
lord said unto me, behold, I have put my word in thi mouth.

1:10 see, I have thi day set thee over the nation and over the
kingdoms, to root out, and to pull down, and to destroy, and to throw
down, to build, and to plant.

1:11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, jeremiah,
what seest thou? and I said, I see a rod of an almond tree.

1:12 then said the lord unto me, thou hast well seen: for I will
hasten my word to perform it.

1:13 and the word of the lord came unto me the second time, saying,
what seest thou? and I said, I see a seeth pot; and the face
thereof is toward the north.

1:14 then the lord said unto me, out of the north an evil shall break
forth upon all the inhabit of the land.

1:15 for, lo, I will call all the famili of the kingdom of the
north, saith the lord; and they shall come, and they shall set every
on hi throne at the enter of the gate of jerusalem, and against
al the wall thereof round about, and against all the citi of
judah.

1:16 and I will utter my judgment against them touch all their
wickedness, who have forsaken me, and have burn incens unto other
gods, and worship the work of their own hands.

1:17 thou therefor gird up thi loins, and arise, and speak unto them
al that I command thee: be not dismay at their faces, lest i
confound thee befor them.

1:18 for, behold, I have made thee thi day a defenc city, and an
iron pillar, and brasen wall against the whole land, against the
k of judah, against the princ thereof, against the priests
thereof, and against the peopl of the land.

1:19 and they shall fight against thee; but they shall not prevail
against thee; for I am with thee, saith the lord, to deliv thee.

2:1 moreov the word of the lord came to me, saying, 2:2 Go and cry
in the ear of jerusalem, saying, thu saith the lord; I remember
thee, the kind of thi youth, the love of thine espousals, when
thou wentest after me in the wilderness, in a land that wa not sown.

2:3 israel wa holi unto the lord, and the firstfruit of his
increase: all that devour him shall offend; evil shall come upon them,
saith the lord.

2:4 hear ye the word of the lord, O hous of jacob, and all the
famili of the hous of israel: 2:5 thu saith the lord, what
iniqu have your father found in me, that they are gone far from
me, and have walk after vanity, and are becom vain?  2:6 neither
said they, where is the lord that brought us up out of the land of
egypt, that led us through the wilderness, through a land of deserts
and of pits, through a land of drought, and of the shadow of death,
through a land that no man pass through, and where no man dwelt?
2:7 and I brought you into a plenti country, to eat the fruit
thereof and the good thereof; but when ye entered, ye defil my
land, and made mine heritag an abomination.

2:8 the priest said not, where is the lord? and they that handl the
law knew me not: the pastor also transgress against me, and the
prophet prophesi by baal, and walk after thing that do not
profit.

2:9 wherefor I will yet plead with you, saith the lord, and with your
children' children will I plead.

2:10 for pass over the isl of chittim, and see; and send unto kedar,
and consid diligently, and see if there be such a thing.

2:11 hath a nation chang their gods, which are yet no gods? but my
peopl have chang their glori for that which doth not profit.

2:12 Be astonished, O ye heavens, at this, and be horribl afraid, be
y veri desolate, saith the lord.

2:13 for my peopl have commit two evils; they have forsaken me the
fountain of live waters, and hew them out cisterns, broken
cisterns, that can hold no water.

2:14 Is israel a servant? is he a homeborn slave? whi is he spoiled?
2:15 the young lion roar upon him, and yelled, and they made his
land waste: hi citi are burn without inhabitant.

2:16 also the children of noph and tahapan have broken the crown of
thi head.

2:17 hast thou not procur thi unto thyself, in that thou hast
forsaken the lord thi god, when he led thee by the way?  2:18 and now
what hast thou to do in the way of egypt, to drink the water of
sihor? or what hast thou to do in the way of assyria, to drink the
wat of the river?  2:19 thine own wicked shall correct thee,
and thi backslid shall reprov thee: know therefor and see that
it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou hast forsaken the lord thy
god, and that my fear is not in thee, saith the lord god of hosts.

2:20 for of old time I have broken thi yoke, and burst thi bands; and
thou saidst, I will not transgress; when upon everi high hill and
und everi green tree thou wanderest, play the harlot.

2:21 yet I had plant thee a nobl vine, wholli a right seed: how
then art thou turn into the degener plant of a strang vine unto
me?  2:22 for though thou wash thee with nitre, and take thee much
soap, yet thine iniqu is mark befor me, saith the lord god.

2:23 how canst thou say, I am not polluted, I have not gone after
baalim?  see thi way in the valley, know what thou hast done: thou art
a swift dromedari travers her ways; 2:24 A wild ass use to the
wilderness, that snuffeth up the wind at her pleasure; in her occasion
who can turn her away? all they that seek her will not weary
themselves; in her month they shall find her.

2:25 withhold thi foot from be unshod, and thi throat from thirst:
but thou saidst, there is no hope: no; for I have love strangers, and
aft them will I go.

2:26 As the thief is asham when he is found, so is the hous of
israel ashamed; they, their kings, their princes, and their priests,
and their prophets.

2:27 say to a stock, thou art my father; and to a stone, thou hast
brought me forth: for they have turn their back unto me, and not
their face: but in the time of their troubl they will say, arise, and
sav us.

2:28 but where are thi god that thou hast made thee? let them arise,
if they can save thee in the time of thi trouble: for accord to the
numb of thi citi are thi gods, O judah.

2:29 wherefor will ye plead with me? ye all have transgress against
me, saith the lord.

2:30 In vain have I smitten your children; they receiv no
correction: your own sword hath devour your prophets, like a
destroy lion.

2:31 O generation, see ye the word of the lord. have I been a
wild unto israel? a land of darkness? wherefor say my people,
w are lords; we will come no more unto thee?  2:32 can a maid forget
h ornaments, or a bride her attire? yet my peopl have forgotten me
day without number.

2:33 whi trimmest thou thi way to seek love? therefor hast thou also
taught the wick one thi ways.

2:34 also in thi skirt is found the blood of the soul of the poor
innocents: I have not found it by secret search, but upon all these.

2:35 yet thou sayest, becaus I am innocent, sure hi anger shall
turn from me. behold, I will plead with thee, becaus thou sayest, i
hav not sinned.

2:36 whi gaddest thou about so much to chang thi way? thou also shalt
b asham of egypt, as thou wast asham of assyria.

2:37 yea, thou shalt go forth from him, and thine hand upon thine
head: for the lord hath reject thi confidences, and thou shalt not
prosp in them.

3:1 they say, If a man put away hi wife, and she go from him, and
becom anoth man's, shall he return unto her again? shall not that
land be greatli polluted? but thou hast play the harlot with many
lovers; yet return again to me, saith the lord.

3:2 lift up thine eye unto the high places, and see where thou hast
not been lien with. In the way hast thou sat for them, as the arabian
in the wilderness; and thou hast pollut the land with thi whoredoms
and with thi wickedness.

3:3 therefor the shower have been withholden, and there hath been no
latt rain; and thou hadst a whore' forehead, thou refusedst to be
ashamed.

3:4 wilt thou not from thi time cri unto me, My father, thou art the
guid of my youth?  3:5 will he reserv hi anger for ever? will he
keep it to the end?  behold, thou hast spoken and done evil thing as
thou couldest.

3:6 the lord said also unto me in the day of josiah the king, hast
thou seen that which backslid israel hath done? she is gone up upon
everi high mountain and under everi green tree, and there hath played
th harlot.

3:7 and I said after she had done all these things, turn thou unto me.
but she return not. and her treacher sister judah saw it.

3:8 and I saw, when for all the caus wherebi backslid israel
commit adulteri I had put her away, and given her a bill of
divorce; yet her treacher sister judah fear not, but went and
play the harlot also.

3:9 and it came to pass through the light of her whoredom, that
sh defil the land, and commit adulteri with stone and with
stocks.

3:10 and yet for all thi her treacher sister judah hath not turned
unto me with her whole heart, but feignedly, saith the lord.

3:11 and the lord said unto me, the backslid israel hath justified
herself more than treacher judah.

3:12 Go and proclaim these word toward the north, and say, return,
th backslid israel, saith the lord; and I will not caus mine
ang to fall upon you: for I am merciful, saith the lord, and I will
not keep anger for ever.

3:13 onli acknowledg thine iniquity, that thou hast transgressed
against the lord thi god, and hast scatter thi way to the strangers
und everi green tree, and ye have not obey my voice, saith the
lord.

3:14 turn, O backslid children, saith the lord; for I am married
unto you: and I will take you one of a city, and two of a family, and
i will bring you to zion: 3:15 and I will give you pastor according
to mine heart, which shall feed you with knowledg and understanding.

3:16 and it shall come to pass, when ye be multipli and increas in
th land, in those days, saith the lord, they shall say no more, the
ark of the coven of the lord: neither shall it come to mind:
neith shall they rememb it; neither shall they visit it; neither
shal that be done ani more.

3:17 At that time they shall call jerusalem the throne of the lord;
and all the nation shall be gather unto it, to the name of the
lord, to jerusalem: neither shall they walk ani more after the
imagin of their evil heart.

3:18 In those day the hous of judah shall walk with the hous of
israel, and they shall come togeth out of the land of the north to
th land that I have given for an inherit unto your fathers.

3:19 but I said, how shall I put thee among the children, and give
the a pleasant land, a goodli heritag of the host of nations? and i
said, thou shalt call me, My father; and shalt not turn away from me.

3:20 sure as a wife treacher departeth from her husband, so
hav ye dealt treacher with me, O hous of israel, saith the
lord.

3:21 A voic wa heard upon the high places, weep and supplications
of the children of israel: for they have pervert their way, and they
hav forgotten the lord their god.

3:22 return, ye backslid children, and I will heal your
backslidings.

behold, we come unto thee; for thou art the lord our god.

3:23 truli in vain is salvat hope for from the hills, and from the
multitud of mountains: truli in the lord our god is the salvat of
israel.

3:24 for shame hath devour the labour of our father from our youth;
their flock and their herds, their son and their daughters.

3:25 We lie down in our shame, and our confus covereth us: for we
hav sin against the lord our god, we and our fathers, from our
youth even unto thi day, and have not obey the voic of the lord
our god.

4:1 If thou wilt return, O israel, saith the lord, return unto me: and
if thou wilt put away thine abomin out of my sight, then shalt
thou not remove.

4:2 and thou shalt swear, the lord liveth, in truth, in judgment, and
in righteousness; and the nation shall bless themselv in him, and
in him shall they glory.

4:3 for thu saith the lord to the men of judah and jerusalem, break
up your fallow ground, and sow not among thorns.

4:4 circumcis yourselv to the lord, and take away the foreskin of
your heart, ye men of judah and inhabit of jerusalem: lest my fury
com forth like fire, and burn that none can quench it, becaus of the
evil of your doings.

4:5 declar ye in judah, and publish in jerusalem; and say, blow ye
th trumpet in the land: cry, gather together, and say, assemble
yourselves, and let us go into the defenc cities.

4:6 set up the standard toward zion: retire, stay not: for I will
br evil from the north, and a great destruction.

4:7 the lion is come up from hi thicket, and the destroy of the
gentil is on hi way; he is gone forth from hi place to make thy
land desolate; and thi citi shall be laid waste, without an
inhabitant.

4:8 for thi gird you with sackcloth, lament and howl: for the fierce
ang of the lord is not turn back from us.

4:9 and it shall come to pass at that day, saith the lord, that the
heart of the king shall perish, and the heart of the princes; and the
priest shall be astonished, and the prophet shall wonder.

4:10 then said I, ah, lord god! sure thou hast greatli deceiv this
peopl and jerusalem, saying, Ye shall have peace; wherea the sword
reacheth unto the soul.

4:11 At that time shall it be said to thi peopl and to jerusalem, a
dri wind of the high place in the wilder toward the daughter of
mi people, not to fan, nor to cleanse, 4:12 even a full wind from
thos place shall come unto me: now also will I give sentenc against
them.

4:13 behold, he shall come up as clouds, and hi chariot shall be as
a whirlwind: hi hors are swifter than eagles. woe unto us! for we
ar spoiled.

4:14 O jerusalem, wash thine heart from wickedness, that thou mayest
b saved. how long shall thi vain thought lodg within thee?  4:15
for a voic declareth from dan, and publisheth afflict from mount
ephraim.

4:16 make ye mention to the nations; behold, publish against
jerusalem, that watcher come from a far country, and give out their
voic against the citi of judah.

4:17 As keeper of a field, are they against her round about; because
sh hath been rebelli against me, saith the lord.

4:18 thi way and thi do have procur these thing unto thee; this
i thi wickedness, becaus it is bitter, becaus it reacheth unto
thin heart.

4:19 My bowels, my bowels! I am pain at my veri heart; my heart
maketh a nois in me; I cannot hold my peace, becaus thou hast heard,
o my soul, the sound of the trumpet, the alarm of war.

4:20 destruct upon destruct is cried; for the whole land is
spoiled: suddenli are my tent spoiled, and my curtain in a moment.

4:21 how long shall I see the standard, and hear the sound of the
trumpet?  4:22 for my peopl is foolish, they have not known me; they
ar sottish children, and they have none understanding: they are wise
to do evil, but to do good they have no knowledge.

4:23 I beheld the earth, and, lo, it wa without form, and void; and
th heavens, and they had no light.

4:24 I beheld the mountains, and, lo, they trembled, and all the hills
mov lightly.

4:25 I beheld, and, lo, there wa no man, and all the bird of the
heaven were fled.

4:26 I beheld, and, lo, the fruit place wa a wilderness, and all
th citi thereof were broken down at the presenc of the lord, and
bi hi fierc anger.

4:27 for thu hath the lord said, the whole land shall be desolate;
yet will I not make a full end.

4:28 for thi shall the earth mourn, and the heaven abov be black;
becaus I have spoken it, I have purpos it, and will not repent,
neith will I turn back from it.

4:29 the whole citi shall flee for the nois of the horsemen and
bowmen; they shall go into thickets, and climb up upon the rocks:
everi citi shall be forsaken, and not a man dwell therein.

4:30 and when thou art spoiled, what wilt thou do? though thou
clothest thyself with crimson, though thou deckest thee with ornaments
of gold, though thou rentest thi face with painting, in vain shalt
thou make thyself fair; thi lover will despis thee, they will seek
thi life.

4:31 for I have heard a voic as of a woman in travail, and the
anguish as of her that bringeth forth her first child, the voic of
th daughter of zion, that bewaileth herself, that spreadeth her
hands, saying, woe is me now! for my soul is weari becaus of
murderers.

5:1 run ye to and fro through the street of jerusalem, and see now,
and know, and seek in the broad place thereof, if ye can find a man,
if there be ani that executeth judgment, that seeketh the truth; and i
wil pardon it.

5:2 and though they say, the lord liveth; sure they swear falsely.

5:3 O lord, are not thine eye upon the truth? thou hast stricken
them, but they have not grieved; thou hast consum them, but they
hav refus to receiv correction: they have made their face harder
than a rock; they have refus to return.

5:4 therefor I said, sure these are poor; they are foolish: for
they know not the way of the lord, nor the judgment of their god.

5:5 I will get me unto the great men, and will speak unto them; for
they have known the way of the lord, and the judgment of their god:
but these have altogeth broken the yoke, and burst the bonds.

5:6 wherefor a lion out of the forest shall slay them, and a wolf of
th even shall spoil them, a leopard shall watch over their
cities: everi one that goeth out thenc shall be torn in pieces:
becaus their transgress are many, and their backslid are
increased.

5:7 how shall I pardon thee for this? thi children have forsaken me,
and sworn by them that are no gods: when I had fed them to the full,
they then commit adultery, and assembl themselv by troop in
th harlots' houses.

5:8 they were as fed hors in the morning: everi one neigh after
hi neighbour' wife.

5:9 shall I not visit for these things? saith the lord: and shall not
mi soul be aveng on such a nation as this?  5:10 Go ye up upon her
walls, and destroy; but make not a full end: take away her
battlements; for they are not the lord's.

5:11 for the hous of israel and the hous of judah have dealt very
treacher against me, saith the lord.

5:12 they have beli the lord, and said, It is not he; neither shall
evil come upon us; neither shall we see sword nor famine: 5:13 and the
prophet shall becom wind, and the word is not in them: thu shall it
b done unto them.

5:14 wherefor thu saith the lord god of hosts, becaus ye speak this
word, behold, I will make my word in thi mouth fire, and thi people
wood, and it shall devour them.

5:15 lo, I will bring a nation upon you from far, O hous of israel,
saith the lord: it is a mighti nation, it is an ancient nation, a
nat whose languag thou knowest not, neither understandest what
they say.

5:16 their quiver is as an open sepulchre, they are all mighti men.

5:17 and they shall eat up thine harvest, and thi bread, which thy
son and thi daughter should eat: they shall eat up thi flock and
thin herds: they shall eat up thi vine and thi fig trees: they shall
impoverish thi fenc cities, wherein thou trustedst, with the sword.

5:18 nevertheless in those days, saith the lord, I will not make a
ful end with you.

5:19 and it shall come to pass, when ye shall say, wherefor doeth the
lord our god all these thing unto us? then shalt thou answer them,
lik as ye have forsaken me, and serv strang god in your land, so
shal ye serv stranger in a land that is not your's.

5:20 declar thi in the hous of jacob, and publish it in judah,
saying, 5:21 hear now this, O foolish people, and without
understanding; which have eyes, and see not; which have ears, and hear
not: 5:22 fear ye not me? saith the lord: will ye not trembl at my
presence, which have place the sand for the bound of the sea by a
perpetu decree, that it cannot pass it: and though the wave thereof
toss themselves, yet can they not prevail; though they roar, yet can
they not pass over it?  5:23 but thi peopl hath a revolt and a
rebelli heart; they are revolt and gone.

5:24 neither say they in their heart, let us now fear the lord our
god, that giveth rain, both the former and the latter, in hi season:
h reserveth unto us the appoint week of the harvest.

5:25 your iniqu have turn away these things, and your sin have
withholden good thing from you.

5:26 for among my peopl are found wick men: they lay wait, as he
that setteth snares; they set a trap, they catch men.

5:27 As a cage is full of birds, so are their hous full of deceit:
therefor they are becom great, and waxen rich.

5:28 they are waxen fat, they shine: yea, they overpass the deed of
th wicked: they judg not the cause, the caus of the fatherless, yet
they prosper; and the right of the needi do they not judge.

5:29 shall I not visit for these things? saith the lord: shall not my
soul be aveng on such a nation as this?  5:30 A wonder and
horr thing is commit in the land; 5:31 the prophet prophesy
falsely, and the priest bear rule by their means; and my peopl love
to have it so: and what will ye do in the end thereof?  6:1 O ye
children of benjamin, gather yourselv to flee out of the midst of
jerusalem, and blow the trumpet in tekoa, and set up a sign of fire in
bethhaccerem: for evil appeareth out of the north, and great
destruction.

6:2 I have liken the daughter of zion to a come and delicate
woman.

6:3 the shepherd with their flock shall come unto her; they shall
pitch their tent against her round about; they shall feed everi one
in hi place.

6:4 prepar ye war against her; arise, and let us go up at noon. woe
unto us! for the day goeth away, for the shadow of the even are
stretch out.

6:5 arise, and let us go by night, and let us destroy her palaces.

6:6 for thu hath the lord of host said, hew ye down trees, and cast
a mount against jerusalem: thi is the citi to be visited; she is
wholli oppress in the midst of her.

6:7 As a fountain casteth out her waters, so she casteth out her
wickedness: violenc and spoil is heard in her; befor me continually
i grief and wounds.

6:8 Be thou instructed, O jerusalem, lest my soul depart from thee;
lest I make thee desolate, a land not inhabited.

6:9 thu saith the lord of hosts, they shall throughli glean the
remn of israel as a vine: turn back thine hand as a grapegatherer
into the baskets.

6:10 To whom shall I speak, and give warning, that they may hear?
behold, their ear is uncircumcised, and they cannot hearken: behold,
th word of the lord is unto them a reproach; they have no delight in
it.

6:11 therefor I am full of the furi of the lord; I am weari with
hold in: I will pour it out upon the children abroad, and upon the
assembl of young men together: for even the husband with the wife
shal be taken, the age with him that is full of days.

6:12 and their hous shall be turn unto others, with their fields
and wive together: for I will stretch out my hand upon the
inhabit of the land, saith the lord.

6:13 for from the least of them even unto the greatest of them every
on is given to covetousness; and from the prophet even unto the
priest everi one dealeth falsely.

6:14 they have heal also the hurt of the daughter of my people
slightly, saying, peace, peace; when there is no peace.

6:15 were they asham when they had commit abomination? nay, they
wer not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefor they
shal fall among them that fall: at the time that I visit them they
shal be cast down, saith the lord.

6:16 thu saith the lord, stand ye in the ways, and see, and ask for
th old paths, where is the good way, and walk therein, and ye shall
find rest for your souls. but they said, We will not walk therein.

6:17 also I set watchmen over you, saying, hearken to the sound of the
trumpet. but they said, We will not hearken.

6:18 therefor hear, ye nations, and know, O congregation, what is
among them.

6:19 hear, O earth: behold, I will bring evil upon thi people, even
th fruit of their thoughts, becaus they have not hearken unto my
words, nor to my law, but reject it.

6:20 To what purpos cometh there to me incens from sheba, and the
sweet cane from a far country? your burnt offer are not
acceptable, nor your sacrific sweet unto me.

6:21 therefor thu saith the lord, behold, I will lay stumblingblocks
befor thi people, and the father and the son togeth shall fall
upon them; the neighbour and hi friend shall perish.

6:22 thu saith the lord, behold, a peopl cometh from the north
country, and a great nation shall be rais from the side of the
earth.

6:23 they shall lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no
mercy; their voic roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses,
set in array as men for war against thee, O daughter of zion.

6:24 We have heard the fame thereof: our hand wax feeble: anguish
hath taken hold of us, and pain, as of a woman in travail.

6:25 Go not forth into the field, nor walk by the way; for the sword
of the enemi and fear is on everi side.

6:26 O daughter of my people, gird thee with sackcloth, and wallow
thyself in ashes: make thee mourning, as for an onli son, most bitter
lamentation: for the spoiler shall suddenli come upon us.

6:27 I have set thee for a tower and a fortress among my people, that
thou mayest know and tri their way.

6:28 they are all grievou revolters, walk with slanders: they are
brass and iron; they are all corrupters.

6:29 the bellow are burned, the lead is consum of the fire; the
found melteth in vain: for the wick are not pluck away.

6:30 reprob silver shall men call them, becaus the lord hath
reject them.

7:1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord, saying, 7:2 stand in
th gate of the lord' house, and proclaim there thi word, and say,
hear the word of the lord, all ye of judah, that enter in at these
g to worship the lord.

7:3 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel, amend your ways
and your doings, and I will caus you to dwell in thi place.

7:4 trust ye not in lie words, saying, the templ of the lord, the
templ of the lord, the templ of the lord, are these.

7:5 for if ye throughli amend your way and your doings; if ye
throughli execut judgment between a man and hi neighbour; 7:6 If ye
oppress not the stranger, the fatherless, and the widow, and shed not
innoc blood in thi place, neither walk after other god to your
hurt: 7:7 then will I caus you to dwell in thi place, in the land
that I gave to your fathers, for ever and ever.

7:8 behold, ye trust in lie words, that cannot profit.

7:9 will ye steal, murder, and commit adultery, and swear falsely, and
burn incens unto baal, and walk after other god whom ye know not;
7:10 and come and stand befor me in thi house, which is call by my
name, and say, We are deliv to do all these abominations?  7:11 is
thi house, which is call by my name, becom a den of robber in
your eyes? behold, even I have seen it, saith the lord.

7:12 but go ye now unto my place which wa in shiloh, where I set my
nam at the first, and see what I did to it for the wicked of my
peopl israel.

7:13 and now, becaus ye have done all these works, saith the lord,
and I spake unto you, rise up earli and speaking, but ye heard not;
and I call you, but ye answer not; 7:14 therefor will I do unto
thi house, which is call by my name, wherein ye trust, and unto the
plac which I gave to you and to your fathers, as I have done to
shiloh.

7:15 and I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your
brethren, even the whole seed of ephraim.

7:16 therefor pray not thou for thi people, neither lift up cri nor
pray for them, neither make intercess to me: for I will not hear
thee.

7:17 seest thou not what they do in the citi of judah and in the
street of jerusalem?  7:18 the children gather wood, and the fathers
kindl the fire, and the women knead their dough, to make cake to the
queen of heaven, and to pour out drink offer unto other gods, that
they may provok me to anger.

7:19 Do they provok me to anger? saith the lord: do they not provoke
themselv to the confus of their own faces?  7:20 therefor thus
saith the lord god; behold, mine anger and my furi shall be pour out
upon thi place, upon man, and upon beast, and upon the tree of the
field, and upon the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall
not be quenched.

7:21 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; put your burnt
off unto your sacrifices, and eat flesh.

7:22 for I spake not unto your fathers, nor command them in the day
that I brought them out of the land of egypt, concern burnt
off or sacrifices: 7:23 but thi thing command I them, saying,
obey my voice, and I will be your god, and ye shall be my people: and
walk ye in all the way that I have command you, that it may be well
unto you.

7:24 but they hearken not, nor inclin their ear, but walk in the
counsel and in the imagin of their evil heart, and went
backward, and not forward.

7:25 sinc the day that your father came forth out of the land of
egypt unto thi day I have even sent unto you all my servant the
prophets, daili rise up earli and send them: 7:26 yet they
hearken not unto me, nor inclin their ear, but harden their
neck: they did wors than their fathers.

7:27 therefor thou shalt speak all these word unto them; but they
wil not hearken to thee: thou shalt also call unto them; but they
wil not answer thee.

7:28 but thou shalt say unto them, thi is a nation that obeyeth not
th voic of the lord their god, nor receiveth correction: truth is
perished, and is cut off from their mouth.

7:29 cut off thine hair, O jerusalem, and cast it away, and take up a
lament on high places; for the lord hath reject and forsaken
th gener of hi wrath.

7:30 for the children of judah have done evil in my sight, saith the
lord: they have set their abomin in the hous which is call by
mi name, to pollut it.

7:31 and they have built the high place of tophet, which is in the
valley of the son of hinnom, to burn their son and their daughter in
th fire; which I command them not, neither came it into my heart.

7:32 therefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that it shall
no more be call tophet, nor the valley of the son of hinnom, but the
valley of slaughter: for they shall buri in tophet, till there be no
place.

7:33 and the carcas of thi peopl shall be meat for the fowl of
th heaven, and for the beast of the earth; and none shall fray them
away.

7:34 then will I caus to ceas from the citi of judah, and from the
street of jerusalem, the voic of mirth, and the voic of gladness,
th voic of the bridegroom, and the voic of the bride: for the land
shal be desolate.

8:1 At that time, saith the lord, they shall bring out the bone of
th king of judah, and the bone of hi princes, and the bone of the
priests, and the bone of the prophets, and the bone of the
inhabit of jerusalem, out of their graves: 8:2 and they shall
spread them befor the sun, and the moon, and all the host of heaven,
whom they have loved, and whom they have served, and after whom they
hav walked, and whom they have sought, and whom they have worshipped:
they shall not be gathered, nor be buried; they shall be for dung upon
th face of the earth.

8:3 and death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residu of
them that remain of thi evil family, which remain in all the places
whith I have driven them, saith the lord of hosts.

8:4 moreov thou shalt say unto them, thu saith the lord; shall they
fall, and not arise? shall he turn away, and not return?  8:5 whi then
i thi peopl of jerusalem slidden back by a perpetu backsliding?
they hold fast deceit, they refus to return.

8:6 I hearken and heard, but they spake not aright: no man repented
him of hi wickedness, saying, what have I done? everi one turn to
hi course, as the hors rusheth into the battle.

8:7 yea, the stork in the heaven knoweth her appoint times; and the
turtl and the crane and the swallow observ the time of their coming;
but my peopl know not the judgment of the lord.

8:8 how do ye say, We are wise, and the law of the lord is with us?
lo, certainli in vain made he it; the pen of the scribe is in vain.

8:9 the wise men are ashamed, they are dismay and taken: lo, they
hav reject the word of the lord; and what wisdom is in them?  8:10
therefor will I give their wive unto others, and their field to
them that shall inherit them: for everi one from the least even unto
th greatest is given to covetousness, from the prophet even unto the
priest everi one dealeth falsely.

8:11 for they have heal the hurt of the daughter of my people
slightly, saying, peace, peace; when there is no peace.

8:12 were they asham when they had commit abomination? nay, they
wer not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefor shall
they fall among them that fall: in the time of their visit they
shal be cast down, saith the lord.

8:13 I will sure consum them, saith the lord: there shall be no
grap on the vine, nor fig on the fig tree, and the leaf shall fade;
and the thing that I have given them shall pass away from them.

8:14 whi do we sit still? assembl yourselves, and let us enter into
th defenc cities, and let us be silent there: for the lord our god
hath put us to silence, and given us water of gall to drink, because
w have sin against the lord.

8:15 We look for peace, but no good came; and for a time of health,
and behold trouble!  8:16 the snort of hi hors wa heard from
dan: the whole land trembl at the sound of the neigh of his
strong ones; for they are come, and have devour the land, and all
that is in it; the city, and those that dwell therein.

8:17 for, behold, I will send serpents, cockatrices, among you, which
wil not be charmed, and they shall bite you, saith the lord.

8:18 when I would comfort myself against sorrow, my heart is faint in
me.

8:19 behold the voic of the cri of the daughter of my peopl because
of them that dwell in a far country: Is not the lord in zion? is not
her king in her? whi have they provok me to anger with their graven
images, and with strang vanities?  8:20 the harvest is past, the
summ is ended, and we are not saved.

8:21 for the hurt of the daughter of my peopl am I hurt; I am black;
astonish hath taken hold on me.

8:22 Is there no balm in gilead; is there no physician there? whi then
i not the health of the daughter of my peopl recovered?  9:1 Oh that
mi head were waters, and mine eye a fountain of tears, that I might
weep day and night for the slain of the daughter of my people!  9:2 oh
that I had in the wilder a lodg place of wayfar men; that i
might leav my people, and go from them! for they be all adulterers,
an assembl of treacher men.

9:3 and they bend their tongu like their bow for lies: but they are
not valiant for the truth upon the earth; for they proceed from evil
to evil, and they know not me, saith the lord.

9:4 take ye heed everi one of hi neighbour, and trust ye not in any
brother: for everi brother will utterli supplant, and everi neighbour
wil walk with slanders.

9:5 and they will deceiv everi one hi neighbour, and will not speak
th truth: they have taught their tongu to speak lies, and weary
themselv to commit iniquity.

9:6 thine habit is in the midst of deceit; through deceit they
refus to know me, saith the lord.

9:7 therefor thu saith the lord of hosts, behold, I will melt them,
and tri them; for how shall I do for the daughter of my people?  9:8
their tongu is as an arrow shot out; it speaketh deceit: one speaketh
peac to hi neighbour with hi mouth, but in heart he layeth his
wait.

9:9 shall I not visit them for these things? saith the lord: shall not
mi soul be aveng on such a nation as this?  9:10 for the mountains
wil I take up a weep and wailing, and for the habit of the
wild a lamentation, becaus they are burn up, so that none can
pass through them; neither can men hear the voic of the cattle; both
th fowl of the heaven and the beast are fled; they are gone.

9:11 and I will make jerusalem heaps, and a den of dragons; and I will
mak the citi of judah desolate, without an inhabitant.

9:12 who is the wise man, that may understand this? and who is he to
whom the mouth of the lord hath spoken, that he may declar it, for
what the land perisheth and is burn up like a wilderness, that none
passeth through?  9:13 and the lord saith, becaus they have forsaken
mi law which I set befor them, and have not obey my voice, neither
walk therein; 9:14 but have walk after the imagin of their
own heart, and after baalim, which their father taught them: 9:15
therefor thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; behold, i
wil feed them, even thi people, with wormwood, and give them water
of gall to drink.

9:16 I will scatter them also among the heathen, whom neither they nor
their father have known: and I will send a sword after them, till i
hav consum them.

9:17 thu saith the lord of hosts, consid ye, and call for the
mourn women, that they may come; and send for cun women, that
they may come: 9:18 and let them make haste, and take up a wail for
us, that our eye may run down with tears, and our eyelid gush out
with waters.

9:19 for a voic of wail is heard out of zion, how are we spoiled!
w are greatli confounded, becaus we have forsaken the land, because
our dwell have cast us out.

9:20 yet hear the word of the lord, O ye women, and let your ear
rec the word of hi mouth, and teach your daughter wailing, and
everi one her neighbour lamentation.

9:21 for death is come up into our windows, and is enter into our
palaces, to cut off the children from without, and the young men from
th streets.

9:22 speak, thu saith the lord, even the carcas of men shall fall
a dung upon the open field, and as the hand after the harvestman,
and none shall gather them.

9:23 thu saith the lord, let not the wise man glori in hi wisdom,
neith let the mighti man glori in hi might, let not the rich man
glori in hi riches: 9:24 but let him that glorieth glori in this,
that he understandeth and knoweth me, that I am the lord which
exercis lovingkindness, judgment, and righteousness, in the earth:
for in these thing I delight, saith the lord.

9:25 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will punish all
them which are circumcis with the uncircumcised; 9:26 egypt, and
judah, and edom, and the children of ammon, and moab, and all that are
in the utmost corners, that dwell in the wilderness: for all these
n are uncircumcised, and all the hous of israel are
uncircumcis in the heart.

10:1 hear ye the word which the lord speaketh unto you, O hous of
israel: 10:2 thu saith the lord, learn not the way of the heathen,
and be not dismay at the sign of heaven; for the heathen are
dismay at them.

10:3 for the custom of the peopl are vain: for one cutteth a tree
out of the forest, the work of the hand of the workman, with the axe.

10:4 they deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails
and with hammers, that it move not.

10:5 they are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs
b borne, becaus they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they
cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.

10:6 forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O lord; thou art
great, and thi name is great in might.

10:7 who would not fear thee, O king of nations? for to thee doth it
appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in
al their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.

10:8 but they are altogeth brutish and foolish: the stock is a
doctrin of vanities.

10:9 silver spread into plate is brought from tarshish, and gold from
uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hand of the founder: blue
and purpl is their clothing: they are all the work of cun men.

10:10 but the lord is the true god, he is the live god, and an
everlast king: at hi wrath the earth shall tremble, and the
nat shall not be abl to abid hi indignation.

10:11 thu shall ye say unto them, the god that have not made the
heaven and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from
und these heavens.

10:12 He hath made the earth by hi power, he hath establish the
world by hi wisdom, and hath stretch out the heaven by his
discretion.

10:13 when he uttereth hi voice, there is a multitud of water in
th heavens, and he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the
earth; he maketh lightn with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out
of hi treasures.

10:14 everi man is brutish in hi knowledge: everi founder is
confound by the graven image: for hi molten imag is falsehood, and
ther is no breath in them.

10:15 they are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their
visit they shall perish.

10:16 the portion of jacob is not like them: for he is the former of
al things; and israel is the rod of hi inheritance: the lord of
host is hi name.

10:17 gather up thi ware out of the land, O inhabit of the
fortress.

10:18 for thu saith the lord, behold, I will sling out the
inhabit of the land at thi once, and will distress them, that
they may find it so.

10:19 woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous; but I said, truly
thi is a grief, and I must bear it.

10:20 My tabernacl is spoiled, and all my cord are broken: my
children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to
stretch forth my tent ani more, and to set up my curtains.

10:21 for the pastor are becom brutish, and have not sought the
lord: therefor they shall not prosper, and all their flock shall be
scattered.

10:22 behold, the nois of the bruit is come, and a great commotion
out of the north country, to make the citi of judah desolate, and a
den of dragons.

10:23 O lord, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not
in man that walketh to direct hi steps.

10:24 O lord, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest
thou bring me to nothing.

10:25 pour out thi furi upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon
th famili that call not on thi name: for they have eaten up jacob,
and devour him, and consum him, and have made hi habitation
desolate.

11:1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord saying, 11:2 hear ye
th word of thi covenant, and speak unto the men of judah, and to
th inhabit of jerusalem; 11:3 and say thou unto them, thu saith
th lord god of israel; curs be the man that obeyeth not the words
of thi covenant, 11:4 which I command your father in the day that
i brought them forth out of the land of egypt, from the iron furnace,
saying, obey my voice, and do them, accord to all which I command
you: so shall ye be my people, and I will be your god: 11:5 that I may
perform the oath which I have sworn unto your fathers, to give them a
land flow with milk and honey, as it is thi day. then answer i,
and said, So be it, O lord.

11:6 then the lord said unto me, proclaim all these word in the
citi of judah, and in the street of jerusalem, saying, hear ye the
word of thi covenant, and do them.

11:7 for I earnestli protest unto your father in the day that i
brought them up out of the land of egypt, even unto thi day, rising
earli and protesting, saying, obey my voice.

11:8 yet they obey not, nor inclin their ear, but walk everi one
in the imagin of their evil heart: therefor I will bring upon
them all the word of thi covenant, which I command them to do: but
they did them not.

11:9 and the lord said unto me, A conspiraci is found among the men of
judah, and among the inhabit of jerusalem.

11:10 they are turn back to the iniqu of their forefathers,
which refus to hear my words; and they went after other god to
serv them: the hous of israel and the hous of judah have broken my
coven which I made with their fathers.

11:11 therefor thu saith the lord, behold, I will bring evil upon
them, which they shall not be abl to escape; and though they shall
cri unto me, I will not hearken unto them.

11:12 then shall the citi of judah and inhabit of jerusalem go,
and cri unto the god unto whom they offer incense: but they shall not
sav them at all in the time of their trouble.

11:13 for accord to the number of thi citi were thi gods, o
judah; and accord to the number of the street of jerusalem have ye
set up altar to that shame thing, even altar to burn incens unto
baal.

11:14 therefor pray not thou for thi people, neither lift up a cry
or prayer for them: for I will not hear them in the time that they cry
unto me for their trouble.

11:15 what hath my belov to do in mine house, see she hath
wrought lewd with many, and the holi flesh is pass from thee?
when thou doest evil, then thou rejoicest.

11:16 the lord call thi name, A green oliv tree, fair, and of
goodli fruit: with the nois of a great tumult he hath kindl fire
upon it, and the branch of it are broken.

11:17 for the lord of hosts, that plant thee, hath pronounc evil
against thee, for the evil of the hous of israel and of the hous of
judah, which they have done against themselv to provok me to anger
in offer incens unto baal.

11:18 and the lord hath given me knowledg of it, and I know it: then
thou shewedst me their doings.

11:19 but I wa like a lamb or an ox that is brought to the slaughter;
and I knew not that they had devis devic against me, saying, let
u destroy the tree with the fruit thereof, and let us cut him off
from the land of the living, that hi name may be no more remembered.

11:20 but, O lord of hosts, that judgest righteously, that triest the
rein and the heart, let me see thi vengeanc on them: for unto thee
hav I reveal my cause.

11:21 therefor thu saith the lord of the men of anathoth, that seek
thi life, saying, prophesi not in the name of the lord, that thou die
not by our hand: 11:22 therefor thu saith the lord of hosts, behold,
i will punish them: the young men shall die by the sword; their sons
and their daughter shall die by famine: 11:23 and there shall be no
remn of them: for I will bring evil upon the men of anathoth, even
th year of their visitation.

12:1 righteou art thou, O lord, when I plead with thee: yet let me
talk with thee of thi judgments: wherefor doth the way of the wicked
prosper?  wherefor are all they happi that deal veri treacherously?
12:2 thou hast plant them, yea, they have taken root: they grow,
yea, they bring forth fruit: thou art near in their mouth, and far
from their reins.

12:3 but thou, O lord, knowest me: thou hast seen me, and tri mine
heart toward thee: pull them out like sheep for the slaughter, and
prepar them for the day of slaughter.

12:4 how long shall the land mourn, and the herb of everi field
wither, for the wicked of them that dwell therein? the beast are
consumed, and the birds; becaus they said, He shall not see our last
end.

12:5 If thou hast run with the footmen, and they have weari thee,
then how canst thou contend with horses? and if in the land of peace,
wherein thou trustedst, they weari thee, then how wilt thou do in
th swell of jordan?  12:6 for even thi brethren, and the hous of
thi father, even they have dealt treacher with thee; yea, they
hav call a multitud after thee: believ them not, though they
speak fair word unto thee.

12:7 I have forsaken mine house, I have left mine heritage; I have
given the dearli belov of my soul into the hand of her enemies.

12:8 mine heritag is unto me as a lion in the forest; it crieth out
against me: therefor have I hate it.

12:9 mine heritag is unto me as a speckl bird, the bird round
about are against her; come ye, assembl all the beast of the field,
com to devour.

12:10 mani pastor have destroy my vineyard, they have trodden my
port under foot, they have made my pleasant portion a desolate
wilderness.

12:11 they have made it desolate, and be desol it mourneth unto
me; the whole land is made desolate, becaus no man layeth it to
heart.

12:12 the spoiler are come upon all high place through the
wilderness: for the sword of the lord shall devour from the one end of
th land even to the other end of the land: no flesh shall have peace.

12:13 they have sown wheat, but shall reap thorns: they have put
themselv to pain, but shall not profit: and they shall be asham of
your revenu becaus of the fierc anger of the lord.

12:14 thu saith the lord against all mine evil neighbours, that touch
th inherit which I have caus my peopl israel to inherit;
behold, I will pluck them out of their land, and pluck out the house
of judah from among them.

12:15 and it shall come to pass, after that I have pluck them out i
wil return, and have compass on them, and will bring them again,
everi man to hi heritage, and everi man to hi land.

12:16 and it shall come to pass, if they will dilig learn the
way of my people, to swear by my name, the lord liveth; as they
taught my peopl to swear by baal; then shall they be built in the
midst of my people.

12:17 but if they will not obey, I will utterli pluck up and destroy
that nation, saith the lord.

13:1 thu saith the lord unto me, Go and get thee a linen girdle, and
put it upon thi loins, and put it not in water.

13:2 So I got a girdl accord to the word of the lord, and put it
on my loins.

13:3 and the word of the lord came unto me the second time, saying,
13:4 take the girdl that thou hast got, which is upon thi loins, and
arise, go to euphrates, and hide it there in a hole of the rock.

13:5 So I went, and hid it by euphrates, as the lord command me.

13:6 and it came to pass after mani days, that the lord said unto me,
arise, go to euphrates, and take the girdl from thence, which i
command thee to hide there.

13:7 then I went to euphrates, and digged, and took the girdl from
th place where I had hid it: and, behold, the girdl wa marred, it
wa profit for nothing.

13:8 then the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 13:9 thu saith
th lord, after thi manner will I mar the pride of judah, and the
great pride of jerusalem.

13:10 thi evil people, which refus to hear my words, which walk in
th imagin of their heart, and walk after other gods, to serve
them, and to worship them, shall even be as thi girdle, which is good
for nothing.

13:11 for as the girdl cleaveth to the loin of a man, so have i
caus to cleav unto me the whole hous of israel and the whole house
of judah, saith the lord; that they might be unto me for a people, and
for a name, and for a praise, and for a glory: but they would not
hear.

13:12 therefor thou shalt speak unto them thi word; thu saith the
lord god of israel, everi bottl shall be fill with wine: and they
shal say unto thee, Do we not certainli know that everi bottl shall
b fill with wine?  13:13 then shalt thou say unto them, thu saith
th lord, behold, I will fill all the inhabit of thi land, even
th king that sit upon david' throne, and the priests, and the
prophets, and all the inhabit of jerusalem, with drunkenness.

13:14 and I will dash them one against another, even the father and
th son together, saith the lord: I will not pity, nor spare, nor
hav mercy, but destroy them.

13:15 hear ye, and give ear; be not proud: for the lord hath spoken.

13:16 give glori to the lord your god, befor he caus darkness, and
befor your feet stumbl upon the dark mountains, and, while ye look
for light, he turn it into the shadow of death, and make it gross
darkness.

13:17 but if ye will not hear it, my soul shall weep in secret places
for your pride; and mine eye shall weep sore, and run down with tears,
becaus the lord' flock is carri away captive.

13:18 say unto the king and to the queen, humbl yourselves, sit down:
for your princip shall come down, even the crown of your glory.

13:19 the citi of the south shall be shut up, and none shall open
them: judah shall be carri away captiv all of it, it shall be
wholli carri away captive.

13:20 lift up your eyes, and behold them that come from the north:
wher is the flock that wa given thee, thi beauti flock?  13:21
what wilt thou say when he shall punish thee? for thou hast taught
them to be captains, and as chief over thee: shall not sorrow take
thee, as a woman in travail?  13:22 and if thou say in thine heart,
wherefor come these thing upon me?  for the great of thine
iniqu are thi skirt discovered, and thi heel made bare.

13:23 can the ethiopian chang hi skin, or the leopard hi spots?
then may ye also do good, that are accustom to do evil.

13:24 therefor will I scatter them as the stubbl that passeth away
bi the wind of the wilderness.

13:25 thi is thi lot, the portion of thi measur from me, saith the
lord; becaus thou hast forgotten me, and trust in falsehood.

13:26 therefor will I discov thi skirt upon thi face, that thy
sham may appear.

13:27 I have seen thine adulteries, and thi neighings, the lewd of
thi whoredom, and thine abomin on the hill in the fields. woe
unto thee, O jerusalem! wilt thou not be made clean? when shall it
onc be?  14:1 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah concerning
th dearth.

14:2 judah mourneth, and the gate thereof languish; they are black
unto the ground; and the cri of jerusalem is gone up.

14:3 and their nobl have sent their littl one to the waters: they
cam to the pits, and found no water; they return with their vessels
empty; they were asham and confounded, and cover their heads.

14:4 becaus the ground is chapt, for there wa no rain in the earth,
th plowmen were ashamed, they cover their heads.

14:5 yea, the hind also calv in the field, and forsook it, because
ther wa no grass.

14:6 and the wild ass did stand in the high places, they snuf up
th wind like dragons; their eye did fail, becaus there wa no
grass.

14:7 O lord, though our iniqu testifi against us, do thou it for
thi name' sake: for our backslid are many; we have sin against
thee.

14:8 O the hope of israel, the saviour thereof in time of trouble, why
shouldest thou be as a stranger in the land, and as a wayfar man
that turneth asid to tarri for a night?  14:9 whi shouldest thou be
a a man astonied, as a mighti man that cannot save? yet thou, O lord,
art in the midst of us, and we are call by thi name; leav us not.

14:10 thu saith the lord unto thi people, thu have they love to
wander, they have not refrain their feet, therefor the lord doth
not accept them; he will now rememb their iniquity, and visit their
sins.

14:11 then said the lord unto me, pray not for thi peopl for their
good.

14:12 when they fast, I will not hear their cry; and when they offer
burnt offer and an oblation, I will not accept them: but I will
consum them by the sword, and by the famine, and by the pestilence.

14:13 then said I, ah, lord god! behold, the prophet say unto them,
y shall not see the sword, neither shall ye have famine; but I will
giv you assur peac in thi place.

14:14 then the lord said unto me, the prophet prophesi lie in my
name: I sent them not, neither have I command them, neither spake
unto them: they prophesi unto you a fals vision and divination, and a
th of nought, and the deceit of their heart.

14:15 therefor thu saith the lord concern the prophet that
prophesi in my name, and I sent them not, yet they say, sword and
famin shall not be in thi land; By sword and famin shall those
prophet be consumed.

14:16 and the peopl to whom they prophesi shall be cast out in the
street of jerusalem becaus of the famin and the sword; and they
shal have none to buri them, them, their wives, nor their sons, nor
their daughters: for I will pour their wicked upon them.

14:17 therefor thou shalt say thi word unto them; let mine eye run
down with tear night and day, and let them not cease: for the virgin
daught of my peopl is broken with a great breach, with a very
griev blow.

14:18 If I go forth into the field, then behold the slain with the
sword!  and if I enter into the city, then behold them that are sick
with famine!  yea, both the prophet and the priest go about into a
land that they know not.

14:19 hast thou utterli reject judah? hath thi soul loth zion? why
hast thou smitten us, and there is no heal for us? we look for
peace, and there is no good; and for the time of healing, and behold
trouble!  14:20 We acknowledge, O lord, our wickedness, and the
iniqu of our fathers: for we have sin against thee.

14:21 Do not abhor us, for thi name' sake, do not disgrac the throne
of thi glory: remember, break not thi coven with us.

14:22 are there ani among the vaniti of the gentil that can cause
rain? or can the heaven give showers? art not thou he, O lord our
god?  therefor we will wait upon thee: for thou hast made all these
things.

15:1 then said the lord unto me, though mose and samuel stood before
me, yet my mind could not be toward thi people: cast them out of my
sight, and let them go forth.

15:2 and it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, whither shall
w go forth? then thou shalt tell them, thu saith the lord; such as
ar for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword;
and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the
captivity, to the captivity.

15:3 and I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the lord: the
sword to slay, and the dog to tear, and the fowl of the heaven, and
th beast of the earth, to devour and destroy.

15:4 and I will caus them to be remov into all kingdom of the
earth, becaus of manasseh the son of hezekiah king of judah, for that
which he did in jerusalem.

15:5 for who shall have piti upon thee, O jerusalem? or who shall
bemoan thee? or who shall go asid to ask how thou doest?  15:6 thou
hast forsaken me, saith the lord, thou art gone backward: therefore
wil I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary
with repenting.

15:7 and I will fan them with a fan in the gate of the land; I will
bereav them of children, I will destroy my peopl sinc they return
not from their ways.

15:8 their widow are increas to me abov the sand of the seas: i
hav brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler
at noonday: I have caus him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors
upon the city.

15:9 she that hath born seven languisheth: she hath given up the
ghost; her sun is gone down while it wa yet day: she hath been
asham and confounded: and the residu of them will I deliv to the
sword befor their enemies, saith the lord.

15:10 woe is me, my mother, that thou hast born me a man of strife
and a man of content to the whole earth! I have neither lent on
usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet everi one of them doth
curs me.

15:11 the lord said, verili it shall be well with thi remnant; verily
i will caus the enemi to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in
th time of affliction.

15:12 shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?  15:13 thy
subst and thi treasur will I give to the spoil without price,
and that for all thi sins, even in all thi borders.

15:14 and I will make thee to pass with thine enemi into a land
which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindl in mine anger, which
shal burn upon you.

15:15 O lord, thou knowest: rememb me, and visit me, and reveng me
of my persecutors; take me not away in thi longsuffering: know that
for thi sake I have suffer rebuke.

15:16 thi word were found, and I did eat them; and thi word wa unto
m the joy and rejoic of mine heart: for I am call by thi name, o
lord god of hosts.

15:17 I sat not in the assembl of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat
alon becaus of thi hand: for thou hast fill me with indignation.

15:18 whi is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth
to be healed? wilt thou be altogeth unto me as a liar, and as waters
that fail?  15:19 therefor thu saith the lord, If thou return, then
wil I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand befor me: and if thou
tak forth the preciou from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let
them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

15:20 and I will make thee unto thi peopl a fenc brasen wall: and
they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against
thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliv thee, saith the
lord.

15:21 and I will deliv thee out of the hand of the wicked, and i
wil redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.

16:1 the word of the lord came also unto me, saying, 16:2 thou shalt
not take thee a wife, neither shalt thou have son or daughter in
thi place.

16:3 for thu saith the lord concern the son and concern the
daught that are born in thi place, and concern their mothers
that bare them, and concern their father that begat them in this
land; 16:4 they shall die of grievou deaths; they shall not be
lamented; neither shall they be buried; but they shall be as dung upon
th face of the earth: and they shall be consum by the sword, and by
famine; and their carcas shall be meat for the fowl of heaven, and
for the beast of the earth.

16:5 for thu saith the lord, enter not into the hous of mourning,
neith go to lament nor bemoan them: for I have taken away my peace
from thi people, saith the lord, even lovingkind and mercies.

16:6 both the great and the small shall die in thi land: they shall
not be buried, neither shall men lament for them, nor cut themselves,
nor make themselv bald for them: 16:7 neither shall men tear
themselv for them in mourning, to comfort them for the dead; neither
shal men give them the cup of consol to drink for their father
or for their mother.

16:8 thou shalt not also go into the hous of feasting, to sit with
them to eat and to drink.

16:9 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; behold, i
wil caus to ceas out of thi place in your eyes, and in your days,
th voic of mirth, and the voic of gladness, the voic of the
bridegroom, and the voic of the bride.

16:10 and it shall come to pass, when thou shalt shew thi peopl all
thes words, and they shall say unto thee, wherefor hath the lord
pronounc all thi great evil against us? or what is our iniquity? or
what is our sin that we have commit against the lord our god?
16:11 then shalt thou say unto them, becaus your father have
forsaken me, saith the lord, and have walk after other gods, and
hav serv them, and have worship them, and have forsaken me, and
hav not kept my law; 16:12 and ye have done wors than your fathers;
for, behold, ye walk everi one after the imagin of hi evil
heart, that they may not hearken unto me: 16:13 therefor will I cast
you out of thi land into a land that ye know not, neither ye nor your
fathers; and there shall ye serv other god day and night; where i
wil not shew you favour.

16:14 therefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that it shall
no more be said, the lord liveth, that brought up the children of
israel out of the land of egypt; 16:15 but, the lord liveth, that
brought up the children of israel from the land of the north, and from
al the land whither he had driven them: and I will bring them again
into their land that I gave unto their fathers.

16:16 behold, I will send for mani fishers, saith the lord, and they
shal fish them; and after will I send for mani hunters, and they
shal hunt them from everi mountain, and from everi hill, and out of
th hole of the rocks.

16:17 for mine eye are upon all their ways: they are not hid from my
face, neither is their iniqu hid from mine eyes.

16:18 and first I will recompens their iniqu and their sin double;
becaus they have defil my land, they have fill mine inheritance
with the carcas of their detest and abomin things.

16:19 O lord, my strength, and my fortress, and my refug in the day
of affliction, the gentil shall come unto thee from the end of the
earth, and shall say, sure our father have inherit lies, vanity,
and thing wherein there is no profit.

16:20 shall a man make god unto himself, and they are no gods?  16:21
therefore, behold, I will thi onc caus them to know, I will cause
them to know mine hand and my might; and they shall know that my name
i the lord.

17:1 the sin of judah is written with a pen of iron, and with the
point of a diamond: it is graven upon the tabl of their heart, and
upon the horn of your altars; 17:2 whilst their children remember
their altar and their grove by the green tree upon the high hills.

17:3 O my mountain in the field, I will give thi substanc and all thy
treasur to the spoil, and thi high place for sin, throughout all
thi borders.

17:4 and thou, even thyself, shalt discontinu from thine heritage
that I gave thee; and I will caus thee to serv thine enemi in the
land which thou knowest not: for ye have kindl a fire in mine anger,
which shall burn for ever.

17:5 thu saith the lord; curs be the man that trusteth in man, and
maketh flesh hi arm, and whose heart departeth from the lord.

17:6 for he shall be like the heath in the desert, and shall not see
when good cometh; but shall inhabit the parch place in the
wilderness, in a salt land and not inhabited.

17:7 bless is the man that trusteth in the lord, and whose hope the
lord is.

17:8 for he shall be as a tree plant by the waters, and that
spreadeth out her root by the river, and shall not see when heat
cometh, but her leaf shall be green; and shall not be care in the
year of drought, neither shall ceas from yield fruit.

17:9 the heart is deceit abov all things, and desper wicked:
who can know it?  17:10 I the lord search the heart, I tri the reins,
even to give everi man accord to hi ways, and accord to the
fruit of hi doings.

17:11 As the partridg sitteth on eggs, and hatcheth them not; so he
that getteth riches, and not by right, shall leav them in the midst
of hi days, and at hi end shall be a fool.

17:12 A gloriou high throne from the begin is the place of our
sanctuary.

17:13 O lord, the hope of israel, all that forsak thee shall be
ashamed, and they that depart from me shall be written in the earth,
becaus they have forsaken the lord, the fountain of live waters.

17:14 heal me, O lord, and I shall be healed; save me, and I shall be
saved: for thou art my praise.

17:15 behold, they say unto me, where is the word of the lord? let it
com now.

17:16 As for me, I have not hasten from be a pastor to follow
thee: neither have I desir the woeful day; thou knowest: that which
cam out of my lip wa right befor thee.

17:17 Be not a terror unto me: thou art my hope in the day of evil.

17:18 let them be confound that persecut me, but let not me be
confounded: let them be dismayed, but let not me be dismayed: bring
upon them the day of evil, and destroy them with doubl destruction.

17:19 thu said the lord unto me; Go and stand in the gate of the
children of the people, wherebi the king of judah come in, and by the
which they go out, and in all the gate of jerusalem; 17:20 and say
unto them, hear ye the word of the lord, ye king of judah, and all
judah, and all the inhabit of jerusalem, that enter in by these
gates: 17:21 thu saith the lord; take heed to yourselves, and bear no
burden on the sabbath day, nor bring it in by the gate of jerusalem;
17:22 neither carri forth a burden out of your hous on the sabbath
day, neither do ye ani work, but hallow ye the sabbath day, as i
command your fathers.

17:23 but they obey not, neither inclin their ear, but made their
neck stiff, that they might not hear, nor receiv instruction.

17:24 and it shall come to pass, if ye dilig hearken unto me,
saith the lord, to bring in no burden through the gate of thi city
on the sabbath day, but hallow the sabbath day, to do no work therein;
17:25 then shall there enter into the gate of thi citi king and
princ sit upon the throne of david, ride in chariot and on
horses, they, and their princes, the men of judah, and the inhabitants
of jerusalem: and thi citi shall remain for ever.

17:26 and they shall come from the citi of judah, and from the
plac about jerusalem, and from the land of benjamin, and from the
plain, and from the mountains, and from the south, bring burnt
offerings, and sacrifices, and meat offerings, and incense, and
bring sacrific of praise, unto the hous of the lord.

17:27 but if ye will not hearken unto me to hallow the sabbath day,
and not to bear a burden, even enter in at the gate of jerusalem
on the sabbath day; then will I kindl a fire in the gate thereof,
and it shall devour the palac of jerusalem, and it shall not be
quenched.

18:1 the word which came to jeremiah from the lord, saying, 18:2
arise, and go down to the potter' house, and there I will caus thee
to hear my words.

18:3 then I went down to the potter' house, and, behold, he wrought a
work on the wheels.

18:4 and the vessel that he made of clay wa mar in the hand of the
potter: so he made it again anoth vessel, as seem good to the
pott to make it.

18:5 then the word of the lord came to me, saying, 18:6 O hous of
israel, cannot I do with you as thi potter? saith the lord. behold,
a the clay is in the potter' hand, so are ye in mine hand, O house
of israel.

18:7 At what instant I shall speak concern a nation, and concerning
a kingdom, to pluck up, and to pull down, and to destroy it; 18:8 if
that nation, against whom I have pronounced, turn from their evil, i
wil repent of the evil that I thought to do unto them.

18:9 and at what instant I shall speak concern a nation, and
concern a kingdom, to build and to plant it; 18:10 If it do evil in
mi sight, that it obey not my voice, then I will repent of the good,
wherewith I said I would benefit them.

18:11 now therefor go to, speak to the men of judah, and to the
inhabit of jerusalem, saying, thu saith the lord; behold, I frame
evil against you, and devis a devic against you: return ye now every
on from hi evil way, and make your way and your do good.

18:12 and they said, there is no hope: but we will walk after our own
devices, and we will everi one do the imagin of hi evil heart.

18:13 therefor thu saith the lord; ask ye now among the heathen, who
hath heard such things: the virgin of israel hath done a veri horrible
thing.

18:14 will a man leav the snow of lebanon which cometh from the rock
of the field? or shall the cold flow water that come from another
plac be forsaken?  18:15 becaus my peopl hath forgotten me, they
hav burn incens to vanity, and they have caus them to stumbl in
their way from the ancient paths, to walk in paths, in a way not cast
up; 18:16 To make their land desolate, and a perpetu hissing; every
on that passeth therebi shall be astonished, and wag hi head.

18:17 I will scatter them as with an east wind befor the enemy; i
wil shew them the back, and not the face, in the day of their
calamity.

18:18 then said they, come and let us devis devic against jeremiah;
for the law shall not perish from the priest, nor counsel from the
wise, nor the word from the prophet. come, and let us smite him with
th tongue, and let us not give heed to ani of hi words.

18:19 give heed to me, O lord, and hearken to the voic of them that
contend with me.

18:20 shall evil be recompens for good? for they have dig a pit
for my soul. rememb that I stood befor thee to speak good for them,
and to turn away thi wrath from them.

18:21 therefor deliv up their children to the famine, and pour out
their blood by the forc of the sword; and let their wive be bereaved
of their children, and be widows; and let their men be put to death;
let their young men be slain by the sword in battle.

18:22 let a cri be heard from their houses, when thou shalt bring a
troop suddenli upon them: for they have dig a pit to take me, and
hid snare for my feet.

18:23 yet, lord, thou knowest all their counsel against me to slay me:
forg not their iniquity, neither blot out their sin from thi sight,
but let them be overthrown befor thee; deal thu with them in the
tim of thine anger.

19:1 thu saith the lord, Go and get a potter' earthen bottle, and
tak of the ancient of the people, and of the ancient of the
priests; 19:2 and go forth unto the valley of the son of hinnom, which
i by the entri of the east gate, and proclaim there the word that i
shal tell thee, 19:3 and say, hear ye the word of the lord, O kings
of judah, and inhabit of jerusalem; thu saith the lord of hosts,
th god of israel; behold, I will bring evil upon thi place, the
which whosoev heareth, hi ear shall tingle.

19:4 becaus they have forsaken me, and have estrang thi place, and
hav burn incens in it unto other gods, whom neither they nor their
fath have known, nor the king of judah, and have fill thi place
with the blood of innocents; 19:5 they have built also the high places
of baal, to burn their son with fire for burnt offer unto baal,
which I command not, nor spake it, neither came it into my mind:
19:6 therefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that thi place
shal no more be call tophet, nor the valley of the son of hinnom,
but the valley of slaughter.

19:7 and I will make void the counsel of judah and jerusalem in this
place; and I will caus them to fall by the sword befor their
enemies, and by the hand of them that seek their lives: and their
carcas will I give to be meat for the fowl of the heaven, and for
th beast of the earth.

19:8 and I will make thi citi desolate, and an hissing; everi one
that passeth therebi shall be astonish and hiss becaus of all the
plagu thereof.

19:9 and I will caus them to eat the flesh of their son and the
flesh of their daughters, and they shall eat everi one the flesh of
hi friend in the sieg and straitness, wherewith their enemies, and
they that seek their lives, shall straiten them.

19:10 then shalt thou break the bottl in the sight of the men that go
with thee, 19:11 and shalt say unto them, thu saith the lord of
hosts; even so will I break thi peopl and thi city, as one breaketh
a potter' vessel, that cannot be made whole again: and they shall
buri them in tophet, till there be no place to bury.

19:12 thu will I do unto thi place, saith the lord, and to the
inhabit thereof, and even make thi citi as tophet: 19:13 and the
hous of jerusalem, and the hous of the king of judah, shall be
defil as the place of tophet, becaus of all the hous upon whose
roof they have burn incens unto all the host of heaven, and have
pour out drink offer unto other gods.

19:14 then came jeremiah from tophet, whither the lord had sent him to
prophesy; and he stood in the court of the lord' house; and said to
al the people, 19:15 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel;
behold, I will bring upon thi citi and upon all her town all the
evil that I have pronounc against it, becaus they have hardened
their necks, that they might not hear my words.

20:1 now pashur the son of immer the priest, who wa also chief
governor in the hous of the lord, heard that jeremiah prophesied
thes things.

20:2 then pashur smote jeremiah the prophet, and put him in the stocks
that were in the high gate of benjamin, which wa by the hous of the
lord.

20:3 and it came to pass on the morrow, that pashur brought forth
jeremiah out of the stocks. then said jeremiah unto him, the lord hath
not call thi name pashur, but magormissabib.

20:4 for thu saith the lord, behold, I will make thee a terror to
thyself, and to all thi friends: and they shall fall by the sword of
their enemies, and thine eye shall behold it: and I will give all
judah into the hand of the king of babylon, and he shall carri them
capt into babylon, and shall slay them with the sword.

20:5 moreov I will deliv all the strength of thi city, and all
th labour thereof, and all the preciou thing thereof, and all the
treasur of the king of judah will I give into the hand of their
enemies, which shall spoil them, and take them, and carri them to
babylon.

20:6 and thou, pashur, and all that dwell in thine hous shall go into
captivity: and thou shalt come to babylon, and there thou shalt die,
and shalt be buri there, thou, and all thi friends, to whom thou
hast prophesi lies.

20:7 O lord, thou hast deceiv me, and I wa deceived; thou art
strong than I, and hast prevailed: I am in deris daily, everi one
mocketh me.

20:8 for sinc I spake, I cri out, I cri violenc and spoil;
becaus the word of the lord wa made a reproach unto me, and a
derision, daily.

20:9 then I said, I will not make mention of him, nor speak ani more
in hi name. but hi word wa in mine heart as a burn fire shut up
in my bones, and I wa weari with forbearing, and I could not stay.

20:10 for I heard the defam of many, fear on everi side. report,
say they, and we will report it. all my familiar watch for my
halting, saying, peradventur he will be enticed, and we shall prevail
against him, and we shall take our reveng on him.

20:11 but the lord is with me as a mighti terribl one: therefor my
persecutor shall stumble, and they shall not prevail: they shall be
greatli ashamed; for they shall not prosper: their everlasting
confus shall never be forgotten.

20:12 but, O lord of hosts, that triest the righteous, and seest the
rein and the heart, let me see thi vengeanc on them: for unto thee
hav I open my cause.

20:13 sing unto the lord, prais ye the lord: for he hath delivered
th soul of the poor from the hand of evildoers.

20:14 curs be the day wherein I wa born: let not the day wherein my
moth bare me be blessed.

20:15 curs be the man who brought tide to my father, saying, a
man child is born unto thee; make him veri glad.

20:16 and let that man be as the citi which the lord overthrew, and
rep not: and let him hear the cri in the morning, and the
shout at noontide; 20:17 becaus he slew me not from the womb; or
that my mother might have been my grave, and her womb to be always
great with me.

20:18 wherefor came I forth out of the womb to see labour and sorrow,
that my day should be consum with shame?  21:1 the word which came
unto jeremiah from the lord, when king zedekiah sent unto him pashur
th son of melchiah, and zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest,
saying, 21:2 enquire, I pray thee, of the lord for us; for
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon maketh war against us; if so be that
th lord will deal with us accord to all hi wondrou works, that
h may go up from us.

21:3 then said jeremiah unto them, thu shall ye say to zedekiah: 21:4
thu saith the lord god of israel; behold, I will turn back the
weapon of war that are in your hands, wherewith ye fight against the
k of babylon, and against the chaldeans, which besieg you without
th walls, and I will assembl them into the midst of thi city.

21:5 and I myself will fight against you with an outstretch hand and
with a strong arm, even in anger, and in fury, and in great wrath.

21:6 and I will smite the inhabit of thi city, both man and
beast: they shall die of a great pestilence.

21:7 and afterward, saith the lord, I will deliv zedekiah king of
judah, and hi servants, and the people, and such as are left in this
citi from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into
th hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, and into the hand of their
enemies, and into the hand of those that seek their life: and he shall
smit them with the edg of the sword; he shall not spare them,
neith have pity, nor have mercy.

21:8 and unto thi peopl thou shalt say, thu saith the lord; behold,
i set befor you the way of life, and the way of death.

21:9 He that abideth in thi citi shall die by the sword, and by the
famine, and by the pestilence: but he that goeth out, and falleth to
th chaldean that besieg you, he shall live, and hi life shall be
unto him for a prey.

21:10 for I have set my face against thi citi for evil, and not for
good, saith the lord: it shall be given into the hand of the king of
babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

21:11 and touch the hous of the king of judah, say, hear ye the
word of the lord; 21:12 O hous of david, thu saith the lord; execute
judg in the morning, and deliv him that is spoil out of the
hand of the oppressor, lest my furi go out like fire, and burn that
non can quench it, becaus of the evil of your doings.

21:13 behold, I am against thee, O inhabit of the valley, and rock
of the plain, saith the lord; which say, who shall come down against
us? or who shall enter into our habitations?  21:14 but I will punish
y accord to the fruit of your doings, saith the lord: and I will
kindl a fire in the forest thereof, and it shall devour all things
round about it.

22:1 thu saith the lord; Go down to the hous of the king of judah,
and speak there thi word, 22:2 and say, hear the word of the lord, o
k of judah, that sittest upon the throne of david, thou, and thy
servants, and thi peopl that enter in by these gates: 22:3 thu saith
th lord; execut ye judgment and righteousness, and deliv the
spoil out of the hand of the oppressor: and do no wrong, do no
viol to the stranger, the fatherless, nor the widow, neither shed
innoc blood in thi place.
