22:4 for if ye do thi thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the
gat of thi hous king sit upon the throne of david, ride in
chariot and on horses, he, and hi servants, and hi people.

22:5 but if ye will not hear these words, I swear by myself, saith the
lord, that thi hous shall becom a desolation.

22:6 for thu saith the lord unto the king' hous of judah; thou art
gilead unto me, and the head of lebanon: yet sure I will make thee a
wilderness, and citi which are not inhabited.

22:7 and I will prepar destroy against thee, everi one with his
weapons: and they shall cut down thi choic cedars, and cast them into
th fire.

22:8 and mani nation shall pass by thi city, and they shall say
everi man to hi neighbour, wherefor hath the lord done thu unto
thi great city?  22:9 then they shall answer, becaus they have
forsaken the coven of the lord their god, and worship other
gods, and serv them.

22:10 weep ye not for the dead, neither bemoan him: but weep sore for
him that goeth away: for he shall return no more, nor see hi native
country.

22:11 for thu saith the lord touch shallum the son of josiah king
of judah, which reign instead of josiah hi father, which went forth
out of thi place; He shall not return thither ani more: 22:12 but he
shal die in the place whither they have led him captive, and shall
se thi land no more.

22:13 woe unto him that buildeth hi hous by unrighteousness, and his
chamb by wrong; that useth hi neighbour' servic without wages,
and giveth him not for hi work; 22:14 that saith, I will build me a
wid hous and larg chambers, and cutteth him out windows; and it is
ciel with cedar, and paint with vermilion.

22:15 shalt thou reign, becaus thou closest thyself in cedar? did not
thi father eat and drink, and do judgment and justice, and then it was
wel with him?  22:16 He judg the caus of the poor and needy; then
it wa well with him: wa not thi to know me? saith the lord.

22:17 but thine eye and thine heart are not but for thi covetousness,
and for to shed innoc blood, and for oppression, and for violence,
to do it.

22:18 therefor thu saith the lord concern jehoiakim the son of
josiah king of judah; they shall not lament for him, saying, Ah my
brother! or, Ah sister! they shall not lament for him, saying, ah
lord! or, Ah hi glory!  22:19 He shall be buri with the burial of
an ass, drawn and cast forth beyond the gate of jerusalem.

22:20 Go up to lebanon, and cry; and lift up thi voic in bashan, and
cri from the passages: for all thi lover are destroyed.

22:21 I spake unto thee in thi prosperity; but thou saidst, I will not
hear. thi hath been thi manner from thi youth, that thou obeyedst not
mi voice.

22:22 the wind shall eat up all thi pastors, and thi lover shall go
into captivity: sure then shalt thou be asham and confound for
al thi wickedness.

22:23 O inhabit of lebanon, that makest thi nest in the cedars, how
graci shalt thou be when pang come upon thee, the pain as of a
woman in travail!  22:24 As I live, saith the lord, though coniah the
son of jehoiakim king of judah were the signet upon my right hand, yet
would I pluck thee thence; 22:25 and I will give thee into the hand of
them that seek thi life, and into the hand of them whose face thou
fearest, even into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, and
into the hand of the chaldeans.

22:26 and I will cast thee out, and thi mother that bare thee, into
anoth country, where ye were not born; and there shall ye die.

22:27 but to the land whereunto they desir to return, thither shall
they not return.

22:28 Is thi man coniah a despis broken idol? is he a vessel
wherein is no pleasure? wherefor are they cast out, he and hi seed,
and are cast into a land which they know not?  22:29 O earth, earth,
earth, hear the word of the lord.

22:30 thu saith the lord, write ye thi man childless, a man that
shal not prosper in hi days: for no man of hi seed shall prosper,
sit upon the throne of david, and rule ani more in judah.

23:1 woe be unto the pastor that destroy and scatter the sheep of my
pasture! saith the lord.

23:2 therefor thu saith the lord god of israel against the pastors
that feed my people; Ye have scatter my flock, and driven them away,
and have not visit them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of
your doings, saith the lord.

23:3 and I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries
whith I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds;
and they shall be fruit and increase.

23:4 and I will set up shepherd over them which shall feed them: and
they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed, neither shall they be
lacking, saith the lord.

23:5 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will rais unto
david a righteou branch, and a king shall reign and prosper, and
shal execut judgment and justic in the earth.

23:6 In hi day judah shall be saved, and israel shall dwell safely:
and thi is hi name wherebi he shall be called, the lord our
righteousness.

23:7 therefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that they shall
no more say, the lord liveth, which brought up the children of israel
out of the land of egypt; 23:8 but, the lord liveth, which brought up
and which led the seed of the hous of israel out of the north
country, and from all countri whither I had driven them; and they
shal dwell in their own land.

23:9 mine heart within me is broken becaus of the prophets; all my
bon shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine hath
overcome, becaus of the lord, and becaus of the word of his
holiness.

23:10 for the land is full of adulterers; for becaus of swear the
land mourneth; the pleasant place of the wilder are dri up, and
their cours is evil, and their forc is not right.

23:11 for both prophet and priest are profane; yea, in my hous have i
found their wickedness, saith the lord.

23:12 wherefor their way shall be unto them as slipperi way in the
darkness: they shall be driven on, and fall therein: for I will bring
evil upon them, even the year of their visitation, saith the lord.

23:13 and I have seen folli in the prophet of samaria; they
prophesi in baal, and caus my peopl israel to err.

23:14 I have seen also in the prophet of jerusalem an horribl thing:
they commit adultery, and walk in lies: they strengthen also the hands
of evildoers, that none doth return from hi wickedness; they are all
of them unto me as sodom, and the inhabit thereof as gomorrah.

23:15 therefor thu saith the lord of host concern the prophets;
behold, I will feed them with wormwood, and make them drink the water
of gall: for from the prophet of jerusalem is profan gone forth
into all the land.

23:16 thu saith the lord of hosts, hearken not unto the word of the
prophet that prophesi unto you: they make you vain: they speak a
vis of their own heart, and not out of the mouth of the lord.

23:17 they say still unto them that despis me, the lord hath said, ye
shal have peace; and they say unto everi one that walketh after the
imagin of hi own heart, No evil shall come upon you.

23:18 for who hath stood in the counsel of the lord, and hath
perceiv and heard hi word? who hath mark hi word, and heard it?
23:19 behold, a whirlwind of the lord is gone forth in fury, even a
griev whirlwind: it shall fall grievous upon the head of the
wicked.

23:20 the anger of the lord shall not return, until he have executed,
and till he have perform the thought of hi heart: in the latter
day ye shall consid it perfectly.

23:21 I have not sent these prophets, yet they ran: I have not spoken
to them, yet they prophesied.

23:22 but if they had stood in my counsel, and had caus my peopl to
hear my words, then they should have turn them from their evil way,
and from the evil of their doings.

23:23 Am I a god at hand, saith the lord, and not a god afar off?
23:24 can ani hide himself in secret place that I shall not see him?
saith the lord. Do not I fill heaven and earth? saith the lord.

23:25 I have heard what the prophet said, that prophesi lie in my
name, saying, I have dreamed, I have dreamed.

23:26 how long shall thi be in the heart of the prophet that
prophesi lies? yea, they are prophet of the deceit of their own
heart; 23:27 which think to caus my peopl to forget my name by their
dream which they tell everi man to hi neighbour, as their fathers
hav forgotten my name for baal.

23:28 the prophet that hath a dream, let him tell a dream; and he that
hath my word, let him speak my word faithfully. what is the chaff to
th wheat? saith the lord.

23:29 Is not my word like as a fire? saith the lord; and like a hammer
that breaketh the rock in pieces?  23:30 therefore, behold, I am
against the prophets, saith the lord, that steal my word everi one
from hi neighbour.

23:31 behold, I am against the prophets, saith the lord, that use
their tongues, and say, He saith.

23:32 behold, I am against them that prophesi fals dreams, saith the
lord, and do tell them, and caus my peopl to err by their lies, and
bi their lightness; yet I sent them not, nor command them: therefore
they shall not profit thi peopl at all, saith the lord.

23:33 and when thi people, or the prophet, or a priest, shall ask
thee, saying, what is the burden of the lord? thou shalt then say unto
them, what burden? I will even forsak you, saith the lord.

23:34 and as for the prophet, and the priest, and the people, that
shal say, the burden of the lord, I will even punish that man and his
house.

23:35 thu shall ye say everi one to hi neighbour, and everi one to
hi brother, what hath the lord answered? and, what hath the lord
spoken?  23:36 and the burden of the lord shall ye mention no more:
for everi man' word shall be hi burden; for ye have pervert the
word of the live god, of the lord of host our god.

23:37 thu shalt thou say to the prophet, what hath the lord answered
thee? and, what hath the lord spoken?  23:38 but sinc ye say, the
burden of the lord; therefor thu saith the lord; becaus ye say this
word, the burden of the lord, and I have sent unto you, saying, ye
shal not say, the burden of the lord; 23:39 therefore, behold, i,
even I, will utterli forget you, and I will forsak you, and the city
that I gave you and your fathers, and cast you out of my presence:
23:40 and I will bring an everlast reproach upon you, and a
perpetu shame, which shall not be forgotten.

24:1 the lord shew me, and, behold, two basket of fig were set
befor the templ of the lord, after that nebuchadrezzar king of
babylon had carri away captiv jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of
judah, and the princ of judah, with the carpent and smiths, from
jerusalem, and had brought them to babylon.

24:2 one basket had veri good figs, even like the fig that are first
ripe: and the other basket had veri naughti figs, which could not be
eaten, they were so bad.

24:3 then said the lord unto me, what seest thou, jeremiah? and i
said, figs; the good figs, veri good; and the evil, veri evil, that
cannot be eaten, they are so evil.

24:4 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 24:5 thu saith
th lord, the god of israel; like these good figs, so will i
acknowledg them that are carri away captiv of judah, whom I have
s out of thi place into the land of the chaldean for their good.

24:6 for I will set mine eye upon them for good, and I will bring
them again to thi land: and I will build them, and not pull them
down; and I will plant them, and not pluck them up.

24:7 and I will give them an heart to know me, that I am the lord: and
they shall be my people, and I will be their god: for they shall
return unto me with their whole heart.

24:8 and as the evil figs, which cannot be eaten, they are so evil;
sur thu saith the lord, So will I give zedekiah the king of judah,
and hi princes, and the residu of jerusalem, that remain in this
land, and them that dwell in the land of egypt: 24:9 and I will
deliv them to be remov into all the kingdom of the earth for
their hurt, to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in
al place whither I shall drive them.

24:10 and I will send the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, among
them, till they be consum from off the land that I gave unto them
and to their fathers.

25:1 the word that came to jeremiah concern all the peopl of judah
in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of judah, that
wa the first year of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon; 25:2 the which
jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the peopl of judah, and to all
th inhabit of jerusalem, saying, 25:3 from the thirteenth year of
josiah the son of amon king of judah, even unto thi day, that is the
thre and twentieth year, the word of the lord hath come unto me, and
i have spoken unto you, rise earli and speaking; but ye have not
hearkened.

25:4 and the lord hath sent unto you all hi servant the prophets,
ris earli and send them; but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined
your ear to hear.

25:5 they said, turn ye again now everi one from hi evil way, and
from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the lord hath
given unto you and to your father for ever and ever: 25:6 and go not
aft other god to serv them, and to worship them, and provok me
not to anger with the work of your hands; and I will do you no hurt.

25:7 yet ye have not hearken unto me, saith the lord; that ye might
provok me to anger with the work of your hand to your own hurt.

25:8 therefor thu saith the lord of hosts; becaus ye have not heard
mi words, 25:9 behold, I will send and take all the famili of the
north, saith the lord, and nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon, my
servant, and will bring them against thi land, and against the
inhabit thereof, and against all these nation round about, and
wil utterli destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and an
hissing, and perpetu desolations.

25:10 moreov I will take from them the voic of mirth, and the voice
of gladness, the voic of the bridegroom, and the voic of the bride,
th sound of the millstones, and the light of the candle.

25:11 and thi whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment;
and these nation shall serv the king of babylon seventi years.

25:12 and it shall come to pass, when seventi year are accomplished,
that I will punish the king of babylon, and that nation, saith the
lord, for their iniquity, and the land of the chaldeans, and will make
it perpetu desolations.

25:13 and I will bring upon that land all my word which I have
pronounc against it, even all that is written in thi book, which
jeremiah hath prophesi against all the nations.

25:14 for mani nation and great king shall serv themselv of them
also: and I will recompens them accord to their deeds, and
accord to the work of their own hands.

25:15 for thu saith the lord god of israel unto me; take the wine cup
of thi furi at my hand, and caus all the nations, to whom I send
thee, to drink it.

25:16 and they shall drink, and be moved, and be mad, becaus of the
sword that I will send among them.

25:17 then took I the cup at the lord' hand, and made all the nations
to drink, unto whom the lord had sent me: 25:18 To wit, jerusalem, and
th citi of judah, and the king thereof, and the princ thereof,
to make them a desolation, an astonishment, an hissing, and a curse;
a it is thi day; 25:19 pharaoh king of egypt, and hi servants, and
hi princes, and all hi people; 25:20 and all the mingl people, and
al the king of the land of uz, and all the king of the land of the
philistines, and ashkelon, and azzah, and ekron, and the remnant of
ashdod, 25:21 edom, and moab, and the children of ammon, 25:22 and all
th king of tyrus, and all the king of zidon, and the king of the
isl which are beyond the sea, 25:23 dedan, and tema, and buz, and
al that are in the utmost corners, 25:24 and all the king of arabia,
and all the king of the mingl peopl that dwell in the desert,
25:25 and all the king of zimri, and all the king of elam, and all
th king of the medes, 25:26 and all the king of the north, far and
near, one with another, and all the kingdom of the world, which are
upon the face of the earth: and the king of sheshach shall drink after
them.

25:27 therefor thou shalt say unto them, thu saith the lord of
hosts, the god of israel; drink ye, and be drunken, and spue, and
fall, and rise no more, becaus of the sword which I will send among
you.

25:28 and it shall be, if they refus to take the cup at thine hand to
drink, then shalt thou say unto them, thu saith the lord of hosts; ye
shal certainli drink.

25:29 for, lo, I begin to bring evil on the citi which is call by my
name, and should ye be utterli unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished:
for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabit of the earth,
saith the lord of hosts.

25:30 therefor prophesi thou against them all these words, and say
unto them, the lord shall roar from on high, and utter hi voic from
hi holi habitation; he shall mightili roar upon hi habitation; he
shal give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the
inhabit of the earth.

25:31 A nois shall come even to the end of the earth; for the lord
hath a controversi with the nations, he will plead with all flesh; he
wil give them that are wick to the sword, saith the lord.

25:32 thu saith the lord of hosts, behold, evil shall go forth from
nat to nation, and a great whirlwind shall be rais up from the
coast of the earth.

25:33 and the slain of the lord shall be at that day from one end of
th earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall not be
lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the
ground.

25:34 howl, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow yourselv in the ashes,
y princip of the flock: for the day of your slaughter and of your
dispers are accomplished; and ye shall fall like a pleasant
vessel.

25:35 and the shepherd shall have no way to flee, nor the principal
of the flock to escape.

25:36 A voic of the cri of the shepherds, and an howl of the
princip of the flock, shall be heard: for the lord hath spoiled
their pasture.

25:37 and the peaceabl habit are cut down becaus of the fierce
ang of the lord.

25:38 He hath forsaken hi covert, as the lion: for their land is
desol becaus of the fierc of the oppressor, and becaus of
hi fierc anger.

26:1 In the begin of the reign of jehoiakim the son of josiah king
of judah came thi word from the lord, saying, 26:2 thu saith the
lord; stand in the court of the lord' house, and speak unto all the
citi of judah, which come to worship in the lord' house, all the
word that I command thee to speak unto them; diminish not a word:
26:3 If so be they will hearken, and turn everi man from hi evil way,
that I may repent me of the evil, which I purpos to do unto them
becaus of the evil of their doings.

26:4 and thou shalt say unto them, thu saith the lord; If ye will not
hearken to me, to walk in my law, which I have set befor you, 26:5 to
hearken to the word of my servant the prophets, whom I sent unto
you, both rise up early, and send them, but ye have not
hearkened; 26:6 then will I make thi hous like shiloh, and will make
thi citi a curs to all the nation of the earth.

26:7 So the priest and the prophet and all the peopl heard jeremiah
speak these word in the hous of the lord.

26:8 now it came to pass, when jeremiah had made an end of speaking
al that the lord had command him to speak unto all the people, that
th priest and the prophet and all the peopl took him, saying, thou
shalt sure die.

26:9 whi hast thou prophesi in the name of the lord, saying, this
hous shall be like shiloh, and thi citi shall be desol without an
inhabitant?  and all the peopl were gather against jeremiah in the
hous of the lord.

26:10 when the princ of judah heard these things, then they came up
from the king' hous unto the hous of the lord, and sat down in the
entri of the new gate of the lord' house.

26:11 then spake the priest and the prophet unto the princ and to
al the people, saying, thi man is worthi to die; for he hath
prophesi against thi city, as ye have heard with your ears.

26:12 then spake jeremiah unto all the princ and to all the people,
saying, the lord sent me to prophesi against thi hous and against
thi citi all the word that ye have heard.

26:13 therefor now amend your way and your doings, and obey the
voic of the lord your god; and the lord will repent him of the evil
that he hath pronounc against you.

26:14 As for me, behold, I am in your hand: do with me as seemeth good
and meet unto you.

26:15 but know ye for certain, that if ye put me to death, ye shall
sur bring innoc blood upon yourselves, and upon thi city, and
upon the inhabit thereof: for of a truth the lord hath sent me
unto you to speak all these word in your ears.

26:16 then said the princ and all the peopl unto the priest and to
th prophets; thi man is not worthi to die: for he hath spoken to us
in the name of the lord our god.

26:17 then rose up certain of the elder of the land, and spake to all
th assembl of the people, saying, 26:18 micah the morasthite
prophesi in the day of hezekiah king of judah, and spake to all the
peopl of judah, saying, thu saith the lord of hosts; zion shall be
plow like a field, and jerusalem shall becom heaps, and the
mountain of the hous as the high place of a forest.

26:19 did hezekiah king of judah and all judah put him at all to
death?  did he not fear the lord, and besought the lord, and the lord
rep him of the evil which he had pronounc against them? thus
might we procur great evil against our souls.

26:20 and there wa also a man that prophesi in the name of the
lord, urijah the son of shemaiah of kirjathjearim, who prophesied
against thi citi and against thi land accord to all the word of
jeremiah.

26:21 and when jehoiakim the king, with all hi mighti men, and all
th princes, heard hi words, the king sought to put him to death: but
when urijah heard it, he wa afraid, and fled, and went into egypt;
26:22 and jehoiakim the king sent men into egypt, namely, elnathan the
son of achbor, and certain men with him into egypt.

26:23 and they fetch forth urijah out of egypt, and brought him unto
jehoiakim the king; who slew him with the sword, and cast hi dead
bodi into the grave of the common people.

26:24 nevertheless the hand of ahikam the son of shaphan wa with
jeremiah, that they should not give him into the hand of the peopl to
put him to death.

27:1 In the begin of the reign of jehoiakim the son of josiah king
of judah came thi word unto jeremiah from the lord, saying, 27:2 thus
saith the lord to me; make thee bond and yokes, and put them upon thy
neck, 27:3 and send them to the king of edom, and to the king of moab,
and to the king of the ammonites, and to the king of tyrus, and to the
k of zidon, by the hand of the messeng which come to jerusalem
unto zedekiah king of judah; 27:4 and command them to say unto their
masters, thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; thu shall
y say unto your masters; 27:5 I have made the earth, the man and the
beast that are upon the ground, by my great power and by my
outstretch arm, and have given it unto whom it seem meet unto me.

27:6 and now have I given all these land into the hand of
nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon, my servant; and the beast of the
field have I given him also to serv him.

27:7 and all nation shall serv him, and hi son, and hi son' son,
until the veri time of hi land come: and then mani nation and great
k shall serv themselv of him.

27:8 and it shall come to pass, that the nation and kingdom which will
not serv the same nebuchadnezzar the king of babylon, and that will
not put their neck under the yoke of the king of babylon, that nation
wil I punish, saith the lord, with the sword, and with the famine,
and with the pestilence, until I have consum them by hi hand.

27:9 therefor hearken not ye to your prophets, nor to your diviners,
nor to your dreamers, nor to your enchanters, nor to your sorcerers,
which speak unto you, saying, Ye shall not serv the king of babylon:
27:10 for they prophesi a lie unto you, to remov you far from your
land; and that I should drive you out, and ye should perish.

27:11 but the nation that bring their neck under the yoke of the king
of babylon, and serv him, those will I let remain still in their own
land, saith the lord; and they shall till it, and dwell therein.

27:12 I spake also to zedekiah king of judah accord to all these
words, saying, bring your neck under the yoke of the king of babylon,
and serv him and hi people, and live.

27:13 whi will ye die, thou and thi people, by the sword, by the
famine, and by the pestilence, as the lord hath spoken against the
nat that will not serv the king of babylon?  27:14 therefore
hearken not unto the word of the prophet that speak unto you,
saying, Ye shall not serv the king of babylon: for they prophesi a
li unto you.

27:15 for I have not sent them, saith the lord, yet they prophesi a
li in my name; that I might drive you out, and that ye might perish,
ye, and the prophet that prophesi unto you.

27:16 also I spake to the priest and to all thi people, saying, thus
saith the lord; hearken not to the word of your prophet that
prophesi unto you, saying, behold, the vessel of the lord' house
shal now shortli be brought again from babylon: for they prophesi a
li unto you.

27:17 hearken not unto them; serv the king of babylon, and live:
wherefor should thi citi be laid waste?  27:18 but if they be
prophets, and if the word of the lord be with them, let them now make
intercess to the lord of hosts, that the vessel which are left in
th hous of the lord, and in the hous of the king of judah, and at
jerusalem, go not to babylon.

27:19 for thu saith the lord of host concern the pillars, and
concern the sea, and concern the bases, and concern the
residu of the vessel that remain in thi city.

27:20 which nebuchadnezzar king of babylon took not, when he carried
away captiv jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of judah from
jerusalem to babylon, and all the nobl of judah and jerusalem; 27:21
yea, thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel, concern the
vessel that remain in the hous of the lord, and in the hous of the
k of judah and of jerusalem; 27:22 they shall be carri to
babylon, and there shall they be until the day that I visit them,
saith the lord; then will I bring them up, and restor them to this
place.

28:1 and it came to pass the same year, in the begin of the reign
of zedekiah king of judah, in the fourth year, and in the fifth month,
that hananiah the son of azur the prophet, which wa of gibeon, spake
unto me in the hous of the lord, in the presenc of the priest and
of all the people, saying, 28:2 thu speaketh the lord of hosts, the
god of israel, saying, I have broken the yoke of the king of babylon.

28:3 within two full year will I bring again into thi place all the
vessel of the lord' house, that nebuchadnezzar king of babylon took
away from thi place, and carri them to babylon: 28:4 and I will
br again to thi place jeconiah the son of jehoiakim king of judah,
with all the captiv of judah, that went into babylon, saith the
lord: for I will break the yoke of the king of babylon.

28:5 then the prophet jeremiah said unto the prophet hananiah in the
pres of the priests, and in the presenc of all the peopl that
stood in the hous of the lord, 28:6 even the prophet jeremiah said,
amen: the lord do so: the lord perform thi word which thou hast
prophesied, to bring again the vessel of the lord' house, and all
that is carri away captive, from babylon into thi place.

28:7 nevertheless hear thou now thi word that I speak in thine ears,
and in the ear of all the people; 28:8 the prophet that have been
befor me and befor thee of old prophesi both against many
countries, and against great kingdoms, of war, and of evil, and of
pestilence.

28:9 the prophet which prophesieth of peace, when the word of the
prophet shall come to pass, then shall the prophet be known, that the
lord hath truli sent him.

28:10 then hananiah the prophet took the yoke from off the prophet
jeremiah' neck, and brake it.

28:11 and hananiah spake in the presenc of all the people, saying,
thu saith the lord; even so will I break the yoke of nebuchadnezzar
k of babylon from the neck of all nation within the space of two
ful years. and the prophet jeremiah went hi way.

28:12 then the word of the lord came unto jeremiah the prophet, after
that hananiah the prophet had broken the yoke from off the neck of the
prophet jeremiah, saying, 28:13 Go and tell hananiah, saying, thus
saith the lord; thou hast broken the yoke of wood; but thou shalt
mak for them yoke of iron.

28:14 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; I have put
a yoke of iron upon the neck of all these nations, that they may serve
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon; and they shall serv him: and I have
given him the beast of the field also.

28:15 then said the prophet jeremiah unto hananiah the prophet, hear
now, hananiah; the lord hath not sent thee; but thou makest this
peopl to trust in a lie.

28:16 therefor thu saith the lord; behold, I will cast thee from off
th face of the earth: thi year thou shalt die, becaus thou hast
taught rebellion against the lord.

28:17 So hananiah the prophet die the same year in the seventh month.

29:1 now these are the word of the letter that jeremiah the prophet
s from jerusalem unto the residu of the elder which were carried
away captives, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the
peopl whom nebuchadnezzar had carri away captiv from jerusalem to
babylon; 29:2 (after that jeconiah the king, and the queen, and the
eunuchs, the princ of judah and jerusalem, and the carpenters, and
th smiths, were depart from jerusalem;) 29:3 By the hand of elasah
th son of shaphan, and gemariah the son of hilkiah, (whom zedekiah
k of judah sent unto babylon to nebuchadnezzar king of babylon)
saying, 29:4 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel, unto all
that are carri away captives, whom I have caus to be carri away
from jerusalem unto babylon; 29:5 build ye houses, and dwell in them;
and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them; 29:6 take ye wives, and
beget son and daughters; and take wive for your sons, and give your
daught to husbands, that they may bear son and daughters; that ye
may be increas there, and not diminished.

29:7 and seek the peac of the citi whither I have caus you to be
carri away captives, and pray unto the lord for it: for in the peace
thereof shall ye have peace.

29:8 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; let not your
prophet and your diviners, that be in the midst of you, deceiv you,
neith hearken to your dream which ye caus to be dreamed.

29:9 for they prophesi fals unto you in my name: I have not sent
them, saith the lord.

29:10 for thu saith the lord, that after seventi year be
accomplish at babylon I will visit you, and perform my good word
toward you, in caus you to return to thi place.

29:11 for I know the thought that I think toward you, saith the lord,
thought of peace, and not of evil, to give you an expect end.

29:12 then shall ye call upon me, and ye shall go and pray unto me,
and I will hearken unto you.

29:13 and ye shall seek me, and find me, when ye shall search for me
with all your heart.

29:14 and I will be found of you, saith the lord: and I will turn away
your captivity, and I will gather you from all the nations, and from
al the place whither I have driven you, saith the lord; and I will
br you again into the place whenc I caus you to be carri away
captive.

29:15 becaus ye have said, the lord hath rais us up prophet in
babylon; 29:16 know that thu saith the lord of the king that sitteth
upon the throne of david, and of all the peopl that dwelleth in this
city, and of your brethren that are not gone forth with you into
captivity; 29:17 thu saith the lord of hosts; behold, I will send
upon them the sword, the famine, and the pestilence, and will make
them like vile figs, that cannot be eaten, they are so evil.

29:18 and I will persecut them with the sword, with the famine, and
with the pestilence, and will deliv them to be remov to all the
kingdom of the earth, to be a curse, and an astonishment, and an
hissing, and a reproach, among all the nation whither I have driven
them: 29:19 becaus they have not hearken to my words, saith the
lord, which I sent unto them by my servant the prophets, rise up
earli and send them; but ye would not hear, saith the lord.

29:20 hear ye therefor the word of the lord, all ye of the captivity,
whom I have sent from jerusalem to babylon: 29:21 thu saith the lord
of hosts, the god of israel, of ahab the son of kolaiah, and of
zedekiah the son of maaseiah, which prophesi a lie unto you in my
name; behold, I will deliv them into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king
of babylon; and he shall slay them befor your eyes; 29:22 and of them
shal be taken up a curs by all the captiv of judah which are in
babylon, saying, the lord make thee like zedekiah and like ahab, whom
th king of babylon roast in the fire; 29:23 becaus they have
commit villani in israel, and have commit adulteri with their
neighbours' wives, and have spoken lie word in my name, which i
hav not command them; even I know, and am a witness, saith the
lord.

29:24 thu shalt thou also speak to shemaiah the nehelamite, saying,
29:25 thu speaketh the lord of hosts, the god of israel, saying,
becaus thou hast sent letter in thi name unto all the peopl that
ar at jerusalem, and to zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest, and
to all the priests, saying, 29:26 the lord hath made thee priest in
th stead of jehoiada the priest, that ye should be offic in the
hous of the lord, for everi man that is mad, and maketh himself a
prophet, that thou shouldest put him in prison, and in the stocks.

29:27 now therefor whi hast thou not reprov jeremiah of anathoth,
which maketh himself a prophet to you?  29:28 for therefor he sent
unto us in babylon, saying, thi captiv is long: build ye houses,
and dwell in them; and plant gardens, and eat the fruit of them.

29:29 and zephaniah the priest read thi letter in the ear of
jeremiah the prophet.

29:30 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah, saying, 29:31 send
to all them of the captivity, saying, thu saith the lord concerning
shemaiah the nehelamite; becaus that shemaiah hath prophesi unto
you, and I sent him not, and he caus you to trust in a lie: 29:32
therefor thu saith the lord; behold, I will punish shemaiah the
nehelamite, and hi seed: he shall not have a man to dwell among this
people; neither shall he behold the good that I will do for my people,
saith the lord; becaus he hath taught rebellion against the lord.

30:1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord, saying, 30:2 thus
speaketh the lord god of israel, saying, write thee all the word that
i have spoken unto thee in a book.

30:3 for, lo, the day come, saith the lord, that I will bring again
th captiv of my peopl israel and judah, saith the lord: and i
wil caus them to return to the land that I gave to their fathers,
and they shall possess it.

30:4 and these are the word that the lord spake concern israel and
concern judah.

30:5 for thu saith the lord; We have heard a voic of trembling, of
fear, and not of peace.

30:6 ask ye now, and see whether a man doth travail with child?
wherefor do I see everi man with hi hand on hi loins, as a woman
in travail, and all face are turn into paleness?  30:7 alas! for
that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of
jacob' trouble, but he shall be save out of it.

30:8 for it shall come to pass in that day, saith the lord of hosts,
that I will break hi yoke from off thi neck, and will burst thy
bonds, and stranger shall no more serv themselv of him: 30:9 but
they shall serv the lord their god, and david their king, whom I will
rais up unto them.

30:10 therefor fear thou not, O my servant jacob, saith the lord;
neith be dismayed, O israel: for, lo, I will save thee from afar,
and thi seed from the land of their captivity; and jacob shall return,
and shall be in rest, and be quiet, and none shall make him afraid.

30:11 for I am with thee, saith the lord, to save thee: though I make
a full end of all nation whither I have scatter thee, yet I will
not make a full end of thee: but I will correct thee in measure, and
wil not leav thee altogeth unpunished.

30:12 for thu saith the lord, thi bruis is incurable, and thi wound
i grievous.

30:13 there is none to plead thi cause, that thou mayest be bound up:
thou hast no heal medicines.

30:14 all thi lover have forgotten thee; they seek thee not; for i
hav wound thee with the wound of an enemy, with the chastis of
a cruel one, for the multitud of thine iniquity; becaus thi sins
wer increased.

30:15 whi criest thou for thine affliction? thi sorrow is incurable
for the multitud of thine iniquity: becaus thi sin were increased,
i have done these thing unto thee.

30:16 therefor all they that devour thee shall be devoured; and all
thin adversaries, everi one of them, shall go into captivity; and
they that spoil thee shall be a spoil, and all that prey upon thee
wil I give for a prey.

30:17 for I will restor health unto thee, and I will heal thee of thy
wounds, saith the lord; becaus they call thee an outcast, saying,
thi is zion, whom no man seeketh after.

30:18 thu saith the lord; behold, I will bring again the captiv of
jacob' tents, and have merci on hi dwellingplaces; and the city
shal be build upon her own heap, and the palac shall remain after
th manner thereof.

30:19 and out of them shall proceed thanksgiv and the voic of them
that make merry: and I will multipli them, and they shall not be few;
i will also glorifi them, and they shall not be small.

30:20 their children also shall be as aforetime, and their
congreg shall be establish befor me, and I will punish all
that oppress them.

30:21 and their nobl shall be of themselves, and their governor
shal proceed from the midst of them; and I will caus him to draw
near, and he shall approach unto me: for who is thi that engag his
heart to approach unto me? saith the lord.

30:22 and ye shall be my people, and I will be your god.

30:23 behold, the whirlwind of the lord goeth forth with fury, a
continu whirlwind: it shall fall with pain upon the head of the
wicked.

30:24 the fierc anger of the lord shall not return, until he hath
don it, and until he have perform the intent of hi heart: in the
latt day ye shall consid it.

31:1 At the same time, saith the lord, will I be the god of all the
famili of israel, and they shall be my people.

31:2 thu saith the lord, the peopl which were left of the sword
found grace in the wilderness; even israel, when I went to caus him
to rest.

31:3 the lord hath appear of old unto me, saying, yea, I have loved
the with an everlast love: therefor with lovingkind have i
drawn thee.

31:4 again I will build thee, and thou shalt be built, O virgin of
israel: thou shalt again be adorn with thi tabrets, and shalt go
forth in the danc of them that make merry.

31:5 thou shalt yet plant vine upon the mountain of samaria: the
plant shall plant, and shall eat them as common things.

31:6 for there shall be a day, that the watchmen upon the mount
ephraim shall cry, aris ye, and let us go up to zion unto the lord
our god.

31:7 for thu saith the lord; sing with glad for jacob, and shout
among the chief of the nations: publish ye, prais ye, and say, o
lord, save thi people, the remnant of israel.

31:8 behold, I will bring them from the north country, and gather them
from the coast of the earth, and with them the blind and the lame,
th woman with child and her that travaileth with child together: a
great compani shall return thither.

31:9 they shall come with weeping, and with supplic will I lead
them: I will caus them to walk by the river of water in a straight
way, wherein they shall not stumble: for I am a father to israel, and
ephraim is my firstborn.

31:10 hear the word of the lord, O ye nations, and declar it in the
isl afar off, and say, He that scatter israel will gather him, and
keep him, as a shepherd doth hi flock.

31:11 for the lord hath redeem jacob, and ransom him from the hand
of him that wa stronger than he.

31:12 therefor they shall come and sing in the height of zion, and
shal flow togeth to the good of the lord, for wheat, and for
wine, and for oil, and for the young of the flock and of the herd: and
their soul shall be as a water garden; and they shall not sorrow any
mor at all.

31:13 then shall the virgin rejoic in the dance, both young men and
old together: for I will turn their mourn into joy, and will
comfort them, and make them rejoic from their sorrow.

31:14 and I will satiat the soul of the priest with fatness, and my
peopl shall be satisfi with my goodness, saith the lord.

31:15 thu saith the lord; A voic wa heard in ramah, lamentation,
and bitter weeping; rahel weep for her children refus to be
comfort for her children, becaus they were not.

31:16 thu saith the lord; refrain thi voic from weeping, and thine
ey from tears: for thi work shall be rewarded, saith the lord; and
they shall come again from the land of the enemy.

31:17 and there is hope in thine end, saith the lord, that thy
children shall come again to their own border.

31:18 I have sure heard ephraim bemoan himself thus; thou hast
chastis me, and I wa chastised, as a bullock unaccustom to the
yoke: turn thou me, and I shall be turned; for thou art the lord my
god.

31:19 sure after that I wa turned, I repented; and after that I was
instructed, I smote upon my thigh: I wa ashamed, yea, even
confounded, becaus I did bear the reproach of my youth.

31:20 Is ephraim my dear son? is he a pleasant child? for sinc i
spak against him, I do earnestli rememb him still: therefor my
bowel are troubl for him; I will sure have merci upon him, saith
th lord.

31:21 set thee up waymarks, make thee high heaps: set thine heart
toward the highway, even the way which thou wentest: turn again, o
virgin of israel, turn again to these thi cities.

31:22 how long wilt thou go about, O thou backslid daughter? for
th lord hath creat a new thing in the earth, A woman shall compass
a man.

31:23 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; As yet they
shal use thi speech in the land of judah and in the citi thereof,
when I shall bring again their captivity; the lord bless thee, o
habit of justice, and mountain of holiness.

31:24 and there shall dwell in judah itself, and in all the cities
thereof together, husbandmen, and they that go forth with flocks.

31:25 for I have satiat the weari soul, and I have replenish every
sorrow soul.

31:26 upon thi I awaked, and beheld; and my sleep wa sweet unto me.

31:27 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will sow the house
of israel and the hous of judah with the seed of man, and with the
se of beast.

31:28 and it shall come to pass, that like as I have watch over
them, to pluck up, and to break down, and to throw down, and to
destroy, and to afflict; so will I watch over them, to build, and to
plant, saith the lord.

31:29 In those day they shall say no more, the father have eaten a
sour grape, and the children' teeth are set on edge.

31:30 but everi one shall die for hi own iniquity: everi man that
eateth the sour grape, hi teeth shall be set on edge.

31:31 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will make a new
coven with the hous of israel, and with the hous of judah: 31:32
not accord to the coven that I made with their father in the
day that I took them by the hand to bring them out of the land of
egypt; which my coven they brake, although I wa an husband unto
them, saith the lord: 31:33 but thi shall be the coven that I will
mak with the hous of israel; after those days, saith the lord, i
wil put my law in their inward parts, and write it in their hearts;
and will be their god, and they shall be my people.

31:34 and they shall teach no more everi man hi neighbour, and every
man hi brother, saying, know the lord: for they shall all know me,
from the least of them unto the greatest of them, saith the lord: for
i will forgiv their iniquity, and I will rememb their sin no more.

31:35 thu saith the lord, which giveth the sun for a light by day,
and the ordin of the moon and of the star for a light by night,
which divideth the sea when the wave thereof roar; the lord of hosts
i hi name: 31:36 If those ordin depart from befor me, saith
th lord, then the seed of israel also shall ceas from be a nation
befor me for ever.

31:37 thu saith the lord; If heaven abov can be measured, and the
found of the earth search out beneath, I will also cast off
al the seed of israel for all that they have done, saith the lord.

31:38 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that the citi shall be
built to the lord from the tower of hananeel unto the gate of the
corner.

31:39 and the measur line shall yet go forth over against it upon
th hill gareb, and shall compass about to goath.

31:40 and the whole valley of the dead bodies, and of the ashes, and
al the field unto the brook of kidron, unto the corner of the horse
g toward the east, shall be holi unto the lord; it shall not be
pluck up, nor thrown down ani more for ever.

32:1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord in the tenth year of
zedekiah king of judah, which wa the eighteenth year of
nebuchadrezzar.

32:2 for then the king of babylon' armi besieg jerusalem: and
jeremiah the prophet wa shut up in the court of the prison, which was
in the king of judah' house.

32:3 for zedekiah king of judah had shut him up, saying, wherefore
dost thou prophesy, and say, thu saith the lord, behold, I will give
thi citi into the hand of the king of babylon, and he shall take it;
32:4 and zedekiah king of judah shall not escap out of the hand of
th chaldeans, but shall sure be deliv into the hand of the king
of babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and hi eyes
shal behold hi eyes; 32:5 and he shall lead zedekiah to babylon, and
ther shall he be until I visit him, saith the lord: though ye fight
with the chaldeans, ye shall not prosper.

32:6 and jeremiah said, the word of the lord came unto me, saying,
32:7 behold, hanameel the son of shallum thine uncl shall come unto
the saying, buy thee my field that is in anathoth: for the right of
redempt is thine to buy it.

32:8 So hanameel mine uncle' son came to me in the court of the
prison accord to the word of the lord, and said unto me, buy my
field, I pray thee, that is in anathoth, which is in the countri of
benjamin: for the right of inherit is thine, and the redempt is
thine; buy it for thyself.

then I knew that thi wa the word of the lord.

32:9 and I bought the field of hanameel my uncle' son, that wa in
anathoth, and weigh him the money, even seventeen shekel of silver.

32:10 and I subscrib the evidence, and seal it, and took
witnesses, and weigh him the money in the balances.

32:11 So I took the evid of the purchase, both that which was
seal accord to the law and custom, and that which wa open: 32:12
and I gave the evid of the purchas unto baruch the son of neriah,
th son of maaseiah, in the sight of hanameel mine uncle' son, and in
th presenc of the wit that subscrib the book of the
purchase, befor all the jew that sat in the court of the prison.

32:13 and I charg baruch befor them, saying, 32:14 thu saith the
lord of hosts, the god of israel; take these evidences, thi evidence
of the purchase, both which is sealed, and thi evid which is
open; and put them in an earthen vessel, that they may continu many
days.

32:15 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; hous and
field and vineyard shall be possess again in thi land.

32:16 now when I had deliv the evid of the purchas unto
baruch the son of neriah, I pray unto the lord, saying, 32:17 ah
lord god! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thi great
pow and stretch out arm, and there is noth too hard for thee:
32:18 thou shewest lovingkind unto thousands, and recompensest the
iniqu of the father into the bosom of their children after them:
th great, the mighti god, the lord of hosts, is hi name, 32:19 great
in counsel, and mighti in work: for thine eye are open upon all the
way of the son of men: to give everi one accord to hi ways, and
accord to the fruit of hi doings: 32:20 which hast set sign and
wond in the land of egypt, even unto thi day, and in israel, and
among other men; and hast made thee a name, as at thi day; 32:21 and
hast brought forth thi peopl israel out of the land of egypt with
signs, and with wonders, and with a strong hand, and with a stretched
out arm, and with great terror; 32:22 and hast given them thi land,
which thou didst swear to their father to give them, a land flowing
with milk and honey; 32:23 and they came in, and possess it; but
they obey not thi voice, neither walk in thi law; they have done
noth of all that thou commandedst them to do: therefor thou hast
caus all thi evil to come upon them: 32:24 behold the mounts, they
ar come unto the citi to take it; and the citi is given into the hand
of the chaldeans, that fight against it, becaus of the sword, and of
th famine, and of the pestilence: and what thou hast spoken is come
to pass; and, behold, thou seest it.

32:25 and thou hast said unto me, O lord god, buy thee the field for
money, and take witnesses; for the citi is given into the hand of the
chaldeans.

32:26 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah, saying, 32:27
behold, I am the lord, the god of all flesh: is there ani thing too
hard for me?  32:28 therefor thu saith the lord; behold, I will give
thi citi into the hand of the chaldeans, and into the hand of
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, and he shall take it: 32:29 and the
chaldeans, that fight against thi city, shall come and set fire on
thi city, and burn it with the houses, upon whose roof they have
off incens unto baal, and pour out drink offer unto other
gods, to provok me to anger.

32:30 for the children of israel and the children of judah have only
don evil befor me from their youth: for the children of israel have
onli provok me to anger with the work of their hands, saith the
lord.

32:31 for thi citi hath been to me as a provoc of mine anger and
of my furi from the day that they built it even unto thi day; that i
should remov it from befor my face, 32:32 becaus of all the evil of
th children of israel and of the children of judah, which they have
don to provok me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their
priests, and their prophets, and the men of judah, and the inhabitants
of jerusalem.

32:33 and they have turn unto me the back, and not the face: though
i taught them, rise up earli and teach them, yet they have not
hearken to receiv instruction.

32:34 but they set their abomin in the house, which is call by
mi name, to defil it.

32:35 and they built the high place of baal, which are in the valley
of the son of hinnom, to caus their son and their daughter to pass
through the fire unto molech; which I command them not, neither came
it into my mind, that they should do thi abomination, to caus judah
to sin.

32:36 and now therefor thu saith the lord, the god of israel,
concern thi city, whereof ye say, It shall be deliv into the
hand of the king of babylon by the sword, and by the famine, and by
th pestilence; 32:37 behold, I will gather them out of all countries,
whith I have driven them in mine anger, and in my fury, and in great
wrath; and I will bring them again unto thi place, and I will cause
them to dwell safely: 32:38 and they shall be my people, and I will be
their god: 32:39 and I will give them one heart, and one way, that
they may fear me for ever, for the good of them, and of their children
aft them: 32:40 and I will make an everlast coven with them,
that I will not turn away from them, to do them good; but I will put
mi fear in their hearts, that they shall not depart from me.

32:41 yea, I will rejoic over them to do them good, and I will plant
them in thi land assuredli with my whole heart and with my whole
soul.

32:42 for thu saith the lord; like as I have brought all thi great
evil upon thi people, so will I bring upon them all the good that i
hav promis them.

32:43 and field shall be bought in thi land, whereof ye say, It is
desol without man or beast; it is given into the hand of the
chaldeans.

32:44 men shall buy field for money, and subscrib evidences, and
seal them, and take wit in the land of benjamin, and in the
plac about jerusalem, and in the citi of judah, and in the cities
of the mountains, and in the citi of the valley, and in the cities
of the south: for I will caus their captiv to return, saith the
lord.

33:1 moreov the word of the lord came unto jeremiah the second time,
whil he wa yet shut up in the court of the prison, saying, 33:2 thus
saith the lord the maker thereof, the lord that form it, to
establish it; the lord is hi name; 33:3 call unto me, and I will
answ thee, and shew thee great and mighti things, which thou knowest
not.

33:4 for thu saith the lord, the god of israel, concern the houses
of thi city, and concern the hous of the king of judah, which
ar thrown down by the mounts, and by the sword; 33:5 they come to
fight with the chaldeans, but it is to fill them with the dead bodies
of men, whom I have slain in mine anger and in my fury, and for all
whos wicked I have hid my face from thi city.

33:6 behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them,
and will reveal unto them the abund of peac and truth.

33:7 and I will caus the captiv of judah and the captiv of
israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.

33:8 and I will cleans them from all their iniquity, wherebi they
hav sin against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities,
wherebi they have sinned, and wherebi they have transgress against
me.

33:9 and it shall be to me a name of joy, a prais and an honour
befor all the nation of the earth, which shall hear all the good
that I do unto them: and they shall fear and trembl for all the
good and for all the prosper that I procur unto it.

33:10 thu saith the lord; again there shall be heard in thi place,
which ye say shall be desol without man and without beast, even in
th citi of judah, and in the street of jerusalem, that are
desolate, without man, and without inhabitant, and without beast,
33:11 the voic of joy, and the voic of gladness, the voic of the
bridegroom, and the voic of the bride, the voic of them that shall
say, prais the lord of hosts: for the lord is good; for hi mercy
endureth for ever: and of them that shall bring the sacrific of
prais into the hous of the lord. for I will caus to return the
capt of the land, as at the first, saith the lord.

33:12 thu saith the lord of hosts; again in thi place, which is
desol without man and without beast, and in all the citi thereof,
shal be an habit of shepherd caus their flock to lie down.

33:13 In the citi of the mountains, in the citi of the vale, and
in the citi of the south, and in the land of benjamin, and in the
plac about jerusalem, and in the citi of judah, shall the flocks
pass again under the hand of him that telleth them, saith the lord.

33:14 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will perform that
good thing which I have promis unto the hous of israel and to the
hous of judah.

33:15 In those days, and at that time, will I caus the branch of
right to grow up unto david; and he shall execut judgment and
right in the land.

33:16 In those day shall judah be saved, and jerusalem shall dwell
safely: and thi is the name wherewith she shall be called, the lord
our righteousness.

33:17 for thu saith the lord; david shall never want a man to sit
upon the throne of the hous of israel; 33:18 neither shall the
priest the levit want a man befor me to offer burnt offerings, and
to kindl meat offerings, and to do sacrific continually.

33:19 and the word of the lord came unto jeremiah, saying, 33:20 thus
saith the lord; If ye can break my coven of the day, and my
coven of the night, and that there should not be day and night in
their season; 33:21 then may also my coven be broken with david my
servant, that he should not have a son to reign upon hi throne; and
with the levit the priests, my ministers.

33:22 As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of
th sea measured: so will I multipli the seed of david my servant, and
th levit that minist unto me.

33:23 moreov the word of the lord came to jeremiah, saying, 33:24
considerest thou not what thi peopl have spoken, saying, the two
famili which the lord hath chosen, he hath even cast them off? thus
they have despis my people, that they should be no more a nation
befor them.

33:25 thu saith the lord; If my coven be not with day and night,
and if I have not appoint the ordin of heaven and earth; 33:26
then will I cast away the seed of jacob and david my servant, so that
i will not take ani of hi seed to be ruler over the seed of abraham,
isaac, and jacob: for I will caus their captiv to return, and have
merci on them.

34:1 the word which came unto jeremiah from the lord, when
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon, and all hi army, and all the kingdoms
of the earth of hi dominion, and all the people, fought against
jerusalem, and against all the citi thereof, saying, 34:2 thu saith
th lord, the god of israel; Go and speak to zedekiah king of judah,
and tell him, thu saith the lord; behold, I will give thi citi into
th hand of the king of babylon, and he shall burn it with fire: 34:3
and thou shalt not escap out of hi hand, but shalt sure be taken,
and deliv into hi hand; and thine eye shall behold the eye of
th king of babylon, and he shall speak with thee mouth to mouth, and
thou shalt go to babylon.

34:4 yet hear the word of the lord, O zedekiah king of judah; thus
saith the lord of thee, thou shalt not die by the sword: 34:5 but thou
shalt die in peace: and with the burn of thi fathers, the former
k which were befor thee, so shall they burn odour for thee; and
they will lament thee, saying, Ah lord! for I have pronounc the
word, saith the lord.

34:6 then jeremiah the prophet spake all these word unto zedekiah
k of judah in jerusalem, 34:7 when the king of babylon' army
fought against jerusalem, and against all the citi of judah that
wer left, against lachish, and against azekah: for these defenced
c remain of the citi of judah.

34:8 thi is the word that came unto jeremiah from the lord, after
that the king zedekiah had made a coven with all the peopl which
wer at jerusalem, to proclaim liberti unto them; 34:9 that everi man
should let hi manservant, and everi man hi maidservant, be an
hebrew or an hebrewess, go free; that none should serv himself of
them, to wit, of a jew hi brother.

34:10 now when all the princes, and all the people, which had entered
into the covenant, heard that everi one should let hi manservant, and
everi one hi maidservant, go free, that none should serv themselves
of them ani more, then they obeyed, and let them go.

34:11 but afterward they turned, and caus the servant and the
handmaids, whom they had let go free, to return, and brought them into
subject for servant and for handmaids.

34:12 therefor the word of the lord came to jeremiah from the lord,
saying, 34:13 thu saith the lord, the god of israel; I made a
coven with your father in the day that I brought them forth out of
th land of egypt, out of the hous of bondmen, saying, 34:14 At the
end of seven year let ye go everi man hi brother an hebrew, which
hath been sold unto thee; and when he hath serv thee six years, thou
shalt let him go free from thee: but your father hearken not unto
me, neither inclin their ear.

34:15 and ye were now turned, and had done right in my sight, in
proclaim liberti everi man to hi neighbour; and ye had made a
coven befor me in the hous which is call by my name: 34:16 but
y turn and pollut my name, and caus everi man hi servant, and
everi man hi handmaid, whom ye had set at liberti at their pleasure,
to return, and brought them into subjection, to be unto you for
serv and for handmaids.

34:17 therefor thu saith the lord; Ye have not hearken unto me, in
proclaim liberty, everi one to hi brother, and everi man to his
neighbour: behold, I proclaim a liberti for you, saith the lord, to
th sword, to the pestilence, and to the famine; and I will make you
to be remov into all the kingdom of the earth.

34:18 and I will give the men that have transgress my covenant,
which have not perform the word of the coven which they had made
befor me, when they cut the calf in twain, and pass between the
part thereof, 34:19 the princ of judah, and the princ of
jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the peopl of the
land, which pass between the part of the calf; 34:20 I will even
g them into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them
that seek their life: and their dead bodi shall be for meat unto the
fowl of the heaven, and to the beast of the earth.

34:21 and zedekiah king of judah and hi princ will I give into the
hand of their enemies, and into the hand of them that seek their life,
and into the hand of the king of babylon' army, which are gone up
from you.

34:22 behold, I will command, saith the lord, and caus them to return
to thi city; and they shall fight against it, and take it, and burn
it with fire: and I will make the citi of judah a desol without
an inhabitant.

35:1 the word which came unto jeremiah from the lord in the day of
jehoiakim the son of josiah king of judah, saying, 35:2 Go unto the
hous of the rechabites, and speak unto them, and bring them into the
hous of the lord, into one of the chambers, and give them wine to
drink.

35:3 then I took jaazaniah the son of jeremiah, the son of habaziniah,
and hi brethren, and all hi sons, and the whole hous of the
rechabites; 35:4 and I brought them into the hous of the lord, into
th chamber of the son of hanan, the son of igdaliah, a man of god,
which wa by the chamber of the princes, which wa abov the chamber
of maaseiah the son of shallum, the keeper of the door: 35:5 and I set
befor the son of the hous of the rechabit pot full of wine, and
cups, and I said unto them, drink ye wine.

35:6 but they said, We will drink no wine: for jonadab the son of
rechab our father command us, saying, Ye shall drink no wine,
neith ye, nor your son for ever: 35:7 neither shall ye build house,
nor sow seed, nor plant vineyard, nor have any: but all your day ye
shal dwell in tents; that ye may live mani day in the land where ye
b strangers.

35:8 thu have we obey the voic of jonadab the son of rechab our
fath in all that he hath charg us, to drink no wine all our days,
we, our wives, our sons, nor our daughters; 35:9 nor to build houses
for us to dwell in: neither have we vineyard, nor field, nor seed:
35:10 but we have dwelt in tents, and have obeyed, and done according
to all that jonadab our father command us.

35:11 but it came to pass, when nebuchadrezzar king of babylon came up
into the land, that we said, come, and let us go to jerusalem for fear
of the armi of the chaldeans, and for fear of the armi of the syrians:
so we dwell at jerusalem.

35:12 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah, saying, 35:13 thus
saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; Go and tell the men of
judah and the inhabit of jerusalem, will ye not receive
instruct to hearken to my words? saith the lord.

35:14 the word of jonadab the son of rechab, that he command his
son not to drink wine, are performed; for unto thi day they drink
none, but obey their father' commandment: notwithstand I have
spoken unto you, rise earli and speaking; but ye hearken not unto
me.

35:15 I have sent also unto you all my servant the prophets, rising
up earli and send them, saying, return ye now everi man from his
evil way, and amend your doings, and go not after other god to serve
them, and ye shall dwell in the land which I have given to you and to
your fathers: but ye have not inclin your ear, nor hearken unto
me.

35:16 becaus the son of jonadab the son of rechab have perform the
command of their father, which he command them; but thi people
hath not hearken unto me: 35:17 therefor thu saith the lord god of
hosts, the god of israel; behold, I will bring upon judah and upon all
th inhabit of jerusalem all the evil that I have pronounced
against them: becaus I have spoken unto them, but they have not
heard; and I have call unto them, but they have not answered.

35:18 and jeremiah said unto the hous of the rechabites, thu saith
th lord of hosts, the god of israel; becaus ye have obey the
command of jonadab your father, and kept all hi precepts, and
don accord unto all that he hath command you: 35:19 therefore
thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; jonadab the son of
rechab shall not want a man to stand befor me for ever.

36:1 and it came to pass in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of
josiah king of judah, that thi word came unto jeremiah from the lord,
saying, 36:2 take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the
word that I have spoken unto thee against israel, and against judah,
and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the
day of josiah, even unto thi day.

36:3 It may be that the hous of judah will hear all the evil which i
purpos to do unto them; that they may return everi man from hi evil
way; that I may forgiv their iniqu and their sin.

36:4 then jeremiah call baruch the son of neriah: and baruch wrote
from the mouth of jeremiah all the word of the lord, which he had
spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.

36:5 and jeremiah command baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go
into the hous of the lord: 36:6 therefor go thou, and read in the
roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the word of the lord in
th ear of the peopl in the lord' hous upon the fast day: and
also thou shalt read them in the ear of all judah that come out of
their cities.

36:7 It may be they will present their supplic befor the lord,
and will return everi one from hi evil way: for great is the anger
and the furi that the lord hath pronounc against thi people.

36:8 and baruch the son of neriah did accord to all that jeremiah
th prophet command him, read in the book the word of the lord
in the lord' house.

36:9 and it came to pass in the fifth year of jehoiakim the son of
josiah king of judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaim a fast
befor the lord to all the peopl in jerusalem, and to all the people
that came from the citi of judah unto jerusalem.

36:10 then read baruch in the book the word of jeremiah in the house
of the lord, in the chamber of gemariah the son of shaphan the scribe,
in the higher court, at the entri of the new gate of the lord' house,
in the ear of all the people.

36:11 when michaiah the son of gemariah, the son of shaphan, had heard
out of the book all the word of the lord, 36:12 then he went down
into the king' house, into the scribe' chamber: and, lo, all the
princ sat there, even elishama the scribe, and delaiah the son of
shemaiah, and elnathan the son of achbor, and gemariah the son of
shaphan, and zedekiah the son of hananiah, and all the princes.

36:13 then michaiah declar unto them all the word that he had
heard, when baruch read the book in the ear of the people.

36:14 therefor all the princ sent jehudi the son of nethaniah, the
son of shelemiah, the son of cushi, unto baruch, saying, take in thine
hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ear of the people, and
come. So baruch the son of neriah took the roll in hi hand, and came
unto them.

36:15 and they said unto him, sit down now, and read it in our ears.
so baruch read it in their ears.

36:16 now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they
wer afraid both one and other, and said unto baruch, We will surely
tel the king of all these words.

36:17 and they ask baruch, saying, tell us now, how didst thou write
al these word at hi mouth?  36:18 then baruch answer them, he
pronounc all these word unto me with hi mouth, and I wrote them
with ink in the book.

36:19 then said the princ unto baruch, go, hide thee, thou and
jeremiah; and let no man know where ye be.

36:20 and they went in to the king into the court, but they laid up
th roll in the chamber of elishama the scribe, and told all the words
in the ear of the king.

36:21 So the king sent jehudi to fetch the roll: and he took it out of
elishama the scribe' chamber. and jehudi read it in the ear of the
king, and in the ear of all the princ which stood besid the king.

36:22 now the king sat in the winterhous in the ninth month: and
ther wa a fire on the hearth burn befor him.

36:23 and it came to pass, that when jehudi had read three or four
leaves, he cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that
wa on the hearth, until all the roll wa consum in the fire that
wa on the hearth.

36:24 yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the
king, nor ani of hi servant that heard all these words.

36:25 nevertheless elnathan and delaiah and gemariah had made
intercess to the king that he would not burn the roll: but he would
not hear them.

36:26 but the king command jerahmeel the son of hammelech, and
seraiah the son of azriel, and shelemiah the son of abdeel, to take
baruch the scribe and jeremiah the prophet: but the lord hid them.

36:27 then the word of the lord came to jeremiah, after that the king
had burn the roll, and the word which baruch wrote at the mouth of
jeremiah, saying, 36:28 take thee again anoth roll, and write in it
al the former word that were in the first roll, which jehoiakim the
k of judah hath burned.

36:29 and thou shalt say to jehoiakim king of judah, thu saith the
lord; thou hast burn thi roll, saying, whi hast thou written
therein, saying, the king of babylon shall certainli come and destroy
thi land, and shall caus to ceas from thenc man and beast?  36:30
therefor thu saith the lord of jehoiakim king of judah; He shall
hav none to sit upon the throne of david: and hi dead bodi shall be
cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.

36:31 and I will punish him and hi seed and hi servant for their
iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabit of
jerusalem, and upon the men of judah, all the evil that I have
pronounc against them; but they hearken not.

36:32 then took jeremiah anoth roll, and gave it to baruch the
scribe, the son of neriah; who wrote therein from the mouth of
jeremiah all the word of the book which jehoiakim king of judah had
burn in the fire: and there were ad besid unto them mani like
words.

37:1 and king zedekiah the son of josiah reign instead of coniah the
son of jehoiakim, whom nebuchadrezzar king of babylon made king in the
land of judah.

37:2 but neither he, nor hi servants, nor the peopl of the land, did
hearken unto the word of the lord, which he spake by the prophet
jeremiah.

37:3 and zedekiah the king sent jehuc the son of shelemiah and
zephaniah the son of maaseiah the priest to the prophet jeremiah,
saying, pray now unto the lord our god for us.

37:4 now jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had
not put him into prison.

37:5 then pharaoh' armi wa come forth out of egypt: and when the
chaldean that besieg jerusalem heard tide of them, they departed
from jerusalem.

37:6 then came the word of the lord unto the prophet jeremiah saying,
37:7 thu saith the lord, the god of israel; thu shall ye say to the
k of judah, that sent you unto me to enquir of me; behold,
pharaoh' army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to egypt
into their own land.

37:8 and the chaldean shall come again, and fight against thi city,
and take it, and burn it with fire.

37:9 thu saith the lord; deceiv not yourselves, saying, the
chaldean shall sure depart from us: for they shall not depart.

37:10 for though ye had smitten the whole armi of the chaldean that
fight against you, and there remain but wound men among them, yet
should they rise up everi man in hi tent, and burn thi citi with
fire.

37:11 and it came to pass, that when the armi of the chaldean was
broken up from jerusalem for fear of pharaoh' army, 37:12 then
jeremiah went forth out of jerusalem to go into the land of benjamin,
to separ himself thenc in the midst of the people.

37:13 and when he wa in the gate of benjamin, a captain of the ward
wa there, whose name wa irijah, the son of shelemiah, the son of
hananiah; and he took jeremiah the prophet, saying, thou fallest away
to the chaldeans.

37:14 then said jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the
chaldeans.

but he hearken not to him: so irijah took jeremiah, and brought him
to the princes.

37:15 wherefor the princ were wroth with jeremiah, and smote him,
and put him in prison in the hous of jonathan the scribe: for they
had made that the prison.

37:16 when jeremiah wa enter into the dungeon, and into the cabins,
and jeremiah had remain there mani days; 37:17 then zedekiah the
k sent, and took him out: and the king ask him secretli in his
house, and said, Is there ani word from the lord? and jeremiah said,
ther is: for, said he, thou shalt be deliv into the hand of the
k of babylon.

37:18 moreov jeremiah said unto king zedekiah, what have I offended
against thee, or against thi servants, or against thi people, that ye
hav put me in prison?  37:19 where are now your prophet which
prophesi unto you, saying, the king of babylon shall not come
against you, nor against thi land?  37:20 therefor hear now, I pray
thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be
accept befor thee; that thou caus me not to return to the hous of
jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.

37:21 then zedekiah the king command that they should commit
jeremiah into the court of the prison, and that they should give him
daili a piec of bread out of the bakers' street, until all the bread
in the citi were spent.

thu jeremiah remain in the court of the prison.

38:1 then shephatiah the son of mattan, and gedaliah the son of
pashur, and jucal the son of shelemiah, and pashur the son of
malchiah, heard the word that jeremiah had spoken unto all the
people, saying, 38:2 thu saith the lord, He that remaineth in this
citi shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence: but
h that goeth forth to the chaldean shall live; for he shall have his
lif for a prey, and shall live.

38:3 thu saith the lord, thi citi shall sure be given into the
hand of the king of babylon' army, which shall take it.

38:4 therefor the princ said unto the king, We beseech thee, let
thi man be put to death: for thu he weakeneth the hand of the men
of war that remain in thi city, and the hand of all the people, in
speak such word unto them: for thi man seeketh not the welfar of
thi people, but the hurt.

38:5 then zedekiah the king said, behold, he is in your hand: for the
k is not he that can do ani thing against you.

38:6 then took they jeremiah, and cast him into the dungeon of
malchiah the son of hammelech, that wa in the court of the prison:
and they let down jeremiah with cords. and in the dungeon there wa no
water, but mire: so jeremiah sunk in the mire.

38:7 now when ebedmelech the ethiopian, one of the eunuch which was
in the king' house, heard that they had put jeremiah in the dungeon;
th king then sit in the gate of benjamin; 38:8 ebedmelech went
forth out of the king' house, and spake to the king saying, 38:9 my
lord the king, these men have done evil in all that they have done to
jeremiah the prophet, whom they have cast into the dungeon; and he is
lik to die for hunger in the place where he is: for there is no more
bread in the city.

38:10 then the king command ebedmelech the ethiopian, saying, take
from henc thirti men with thee, and take up jeremiah the prophet out
of the dungeon, befor he die.

38:11 So ebedmelech took the men with him, and went into the hous of
th king under the treasury, and took thenc old cast clout and old
rotten rags, and let them down by cord into the dungeon to jeremiah.

38:12 and ebedmelech the ethiopian said unto jeremiah, put now these
old cast clout and rotten rag under thine armhol under the cords.
and jeremiah did so.

38:13 So they drew up jeremiah with cords, and took him up out of the
dungeon: and jeremiah remain in the court of the prison.

38:14 then zedekiah the king sent, and took jeremiah the prophet unto
him into the third entri that is in the hous of the lord: and the
k said unto jeremiah, I will ask thee a thing; hide noth from
me.

38:15 then jeremiah said unto zedekiah, If I declar it unto thee,
wilt thou not sure put me to death? and if I give thee counsel, wilt
thou not hearken unto me?  38:16 So zedekiah the king sware secretly
unto jeremiah, saying, As the lord liveth, that made us thi soul, i
wil not put thee to death, neither will I give thee into the hand of
thes men that seek thi life.

38:17 then said jeremiah unto zedekiah, thu saith the lord, the god
of hosts, the god of israel; If thou wilt assuredli go forth unto the
k of babylon' princes, then thi soul shall live, and thi city
shal not be burn with fire; and thou shalt live, and thine house:
38:18 but if thou wilt not go forth to the king of babylon' princes,
then shall thi citi be given into the hand of the chaldeans, and they
shal burn it with fire, and thou shalt not escap out of their hand.

38:19 and zedekiah the king said unto jeremiah, I am afraid of the
jew that are fallen to the chaldeans, lest they deliv me into their
hand, and they mock me.

38:20 but jeremiah said, they shall not deliv thee. obey, I beseech
thee, the voic of the lord, which I speak unto thee: so it shall be
wel unto thee, and thi soul shall live.

38:21 but if thou refus to go forth, thi is the word that the lord
hath shew me: 38:22 and, behold, all the women that are left in the
k of judah' hous shall be brought forth to the king of babylon's
princes, and those women shall say, thi friend have set thee on, and
hav prevail against thee: thi feet are sunk in the mire, and they
ar turn away back.

38:23 So they shall bring out all thi wive and thi children to the
chaldeans: and thou shalt not escap out of their hand, but shalt be
taken by the hand of the king of babylon: and thou shalt caus this
citi to be burn with fire.

38:24 then said zedekiah unto jeremiah, let no man know of these
words, and thou shalt not die.

38:25 but if the princ hear that I have talk with thee, and they
com unto thee, and say unto thee, declar unto us now what thou hast
said unto the king, hide it not from us, and we will not put thee to
death; also what the king said unto thee: 38:26 then thou shalt say
unto them, I present my supplic befor the king, that he would
not caus me to return to jonathan' house, to die there.

38:27 then came all the princ unto jeremiah, and ask him: and he
told them accord to all these word that the king had commanded. so
they left off speak with him; for the matter wa not perceived.

38:28 So jeremiah abod in the court of the prison until the day that
jerusalem wa taken: and he wa there when jerusalem wa taken.

39:1 In the ninth year of zedekiah king of judah, in the tenth month,
cam nebuchadrezzar king of babylon and all hi armi against
jerusalem, and they besieg it.

39:2 and in the eleventh year of zedekiah, in the fourth month, the
ninth day of the month, the citi wa broken up.

39:3 and all the princ of the king of babylon came in, and sat in
th middl gate, even nergalsharezer, samgarnebo, sarsechim, rabsaris,
nergalsharezer, rabmag, with all the residu of the princ of the
k of babylon.

39:4 and it came to pass, that when zedekiah the king of judah saw
them, and all the men of war, then they fled, and went forth out of
th citi by night, by the way of the king' garden, by the gate
betwixt the two walls: and he went out the way of the plain.

39:5 but the chaldeans' armi pursu after them, and overtook zedekiah
in the plain of jericho: and when they had taken him, they brought
