him up to nebuchadnezzar king of babylon to riblah in the land of
hamath, where he gave judgment upon him.

39:6 then the king of babylon slew the son of zedekiah in riblah
befor hi eyes: also the king of babylon slew all the nobl of
judah.

39:7 moreov he put out zedekiah' eyes, and bound him with chains,
to carri him to babylon.

39:8 and the chaldean burn the king' house, and the hous of the
people, with fire, and brake down the wall of jerusalem.

39:9 then nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away captive
into babylon the remnant of the peopl that remain in the city, and
thos that fell away, that fell to him, with the rest of the people
that remained.

39:10 but nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the
people, which had nothing, in the land of judah, and gave them
vineyard and field at the same time.

39:11 now nebuchadrezzar king of babylon gave charg concerning
jeremiah to nebuzaradan the captain of the guard, saying, 39:12 take
him, and look well to him, and do him no harm; but do unto him even as
h shall say unto thee.

39:13 So nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and nebushasban,
rabsaris, and nergalsharezer, rabmag, and all the king of babylon's
princes; 39:14 even they sent, and took jeremiah out of the court of
th prison, and commit him unto gedaliah the son of ahikam the son
of shaphan, that he should carri him home: so he dwelt among the
people.

39:15 now the word of the lord came unto jeremiah, while he wa shut
up in the court of the prison, saying, 39:16 Go and speak to
ebedmelech the ethiopian, saying, thu saith the lord of hosts, the
god of israel; behold, I will bring my word upon thi citi for evil,
and not for good; and they shall be accomplish in that day before
thee.

39:17 but I will deliv thee in that day, saith the lord: and thou
shalt not be given into the hand of the men of whom thou art afraid.

39:18 for I will sure deliv thee, and thou shalt not fall by the
sword, but thi life shall be for a prey unto thee: becaus thou hast
put thi trust in me, saith the lord.

40:1 the word that came to jeremiah from the lord, after that
nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from ramah, when
h had taken him be bound in chain among all that were carried
away captiv of jerusalem and judah, which were carri away captive
unto babylon.

40:2 and the captain of the guard took jeremiah, and said unto him,
th lord thi god hath pronounc thi evil upon thi place.

40:3 now the lord hath brought it, and done accord as he hath said:
becaus ye have sin against the lord, and have not obey his
voice, therefor thi thing is come upon you.

40:4 and now, behold, I loos thee thi day from the chain which were
upon thine hand. If it seem good unto thee to come with me into
babylon, come; and I will look well unto thee: but if it seem ill unto
the to come with me into babylon, forbear: behold, all the land is
befor thee: whither it seemeth good and conveni for thee to go,
thith go.

40:5 now while he wa not yet gone back, he said, Go back also to
gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan, whom the king of
babylon hath made governor over the citi of judah, and dwell with
him among the people: or go wheresoev it seemeth conveni unto
the to go. So the captain of the guard gave him victual and a
reward, and let him go.

40:6 then went jeremiah unto gedaliah the son of ahikam to mizpah; and
dwelt with him among the peopl that were left in the land.

40:7 now when all the captain of the forc which were in the fields,
even they and their men, heard that the king of babylon had made
gedaliah the son of ahikam governor in the land, and had committed
unto him men, and women, and children, and of the poor of the land, of
them that were not carri away captiv to babylon; 40:8 then they
cam to gedaliah to mizpah, even ishmael the son of nethaniah, and
johanan and jonathan the son of kareah, and seraiah the son of
tanhumeth, and the son of ephai the netophathite, and jezaniah the
son of a maachathite, they and their men.

40:9 and gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan sware unto them
and to their men, saying, fear not to serv the chaldeans: dwell in
th land, and serv the king of babylon, and it shall be well with
you.

40:10 As for me, behold, I will dwell at mizpah, to serv the
chaldeans, which will come unto us: but ye, gather ye wine, and summer
fruits, and oil, and put them in your vessels, and dwell in your
citi that ye have taken.

40:11 likewis when all the jew that were in moab, and among the
ammonites, and in edom, and that were in all the countries, heard that
th king of babylon had left a remnant of judah, and that he had set
ov them gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan; 40:12 even
al the jew return out of all place whither they were driven, and
cam to the land of judah, to gedaliah, unto mizpah, and gather wine
and summer fruit veri much.

40:13 moreov johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the
forc that were in the fields, came to gedaliah to mizpah, 40:14 and
said unto him, dost thou certainli know that baali the king of the
ammonit hath sent ishmael the son of nethaniah to slay thee? but
gedaliah the son of ahikam believ them not.

40:15 then johanan the son of kareah spake to gedaliah in mizpah
secretli saying, let me go, I pray thee, and I will slay ishmael the
son of nethaniah, and no man shall know it: wherefor should he slay
thee, that all the jew which are gather unto thee should be
scattered, and the remnant in judah perish?  40:16 but gedaliah the
son of ahikam said unto johanan the son of kareah, thou shalt not do
thi thing: for thou speakest fals of ishmael.

41:1 now it came to pass in the seventh month, that ishmael the son of
nethaniah the son of elishama, of the seed royal, and the princ of
th king, even ten men with him, came unto gedaliah the son of ahikam
to mizpah; and there they did eat bread togeth in mizpah.

41:2 then aros ishmael the son of nethaniah, and the ten men that
wer with him, and smote gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan
with the sword, and slew him, whom the king of babylon had made
governor over the land.

41:3 ishmael also slew all the jew that were with him, even with
gedaliah, at mizpah, and the chaldean that were found there, and the
men of war.

41:4 and it came to pass the second day after he had slain gedaliah,
and no man knew it, 41:5 that there came certain from shechem, from
shiloh, and from samaria, even fourscor men, have their beards
shaven, and their cloth rent, and have cut themselves, with
off and incens in their hand, to bring them to the hous of the
lord.

41:6 and ishmael the son of nethaniah went forth from mizpah to meet
them, weep all along as he went: and it came to pass, as he met
them, he said unto them, come to gedaliah the son of ahikam.

41:7 and it wa so, when they came into the midst of the city, that
ishmael the son of nethaniah slew them, and cast them into the midst
of the pit, he, and the men that were with him.

41:8 but ten men were found among them that said unto ishmael, slay us
not: for we have treasur in the field, of wheat, and of barley, and
of oil, and of honey. So he forbare, and slew them not among their
brethren.

41:9 now the pit wherein ishmael had cast all the dead bodi of the
men, whom he had slain becaus of gedaliah, wa it which asa the king
had made for fear of baasha king of israel: and ishmael the son of
nethaniah fill it with them that were slain.

41:10 then ishmael carri away captiv all the residu of the people
that were in mizpah, even the king' daughters, and all the people
that remain in mizpah, whom nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had
commit to gedaliah the son of ahikam: and ishmael the son of
nethaniah carri them away captive, and depart to go over to the
ammonites.

41:11 but when johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the
forc that were with him, heard of all the evil that ishmael the son
of nethaniah had done, 41:12 then they took all the men, and went to
fight with ishmael the son of nethaniah, and found him by the great
wat that are in gibeon.

41:13 now it came to pass, that when all the peopl which were with
ishmael saw johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the
forc that were with him, then they were glad.

41:14 So all the peopl that ishmael had carri away captiv from
mizpah cast about and returned, and went unto johanan the son of
kareah.

41:15 but ishmael the son of nethaniah escap from johanan with eight
men, and went to the ammonites.

41:16 then took johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the
forc that were with him, all the remnant of the peopl whom he had
recov from ishmael the son of nethaniah, from mizpah, after that
h had slain gedaliah the son of ahikam, even mighti men of war, and
th women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought
again from gibeon: 41:17 and they departed, and dwelt in the
habit of chimham, which is by bethlehem, to go to enter into
egypt, 41:18 becaus of the chaldeans: for they were afraid of them,
becaus ishmael the son of nethaniah had slain gedaliah the son of
ahikam, whom the king of babylon made governor in the land.

42:1 then all the captain of the forces, and johanan the son of
kareah, and jezaniah the son of hoshaiah, and all the peopl from the
least even unto the greatest, came near, 42:2 and said unto jeremiah
th prophet, let, we beseech thee, our supplic be accept before
thee, and pray for us unto the lord thi god, even for all this
remnant; (for we are left but a few of many, as thine eye do behold
us:) 42:3 that the lord thi god may shew us the way wherein we may
walk, and the thing that we may do.

42:4 then jeremiah the prophet said unto them, I have heard you;
behold, I will pray unto the lord your god accord to your words;
and it shall come to pass, that whatsoev thing the lord shall answer
you, I will declar it unto you; I will keep noth back from you.

42:5 then they said to jeremiah, the lord be a true and faithful
wit between us, if we do not even accord to all thing for the
which the lord thi god shall send thee to us.

42:6 whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice
of the lord our god, to whom we send thee; that it may be well with
us, when we obey the voic of the lord our god.

42:7 and it came to pass after ten days, that the word of the lord
cam unto jeremiah.

42:8 then call he johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of
th forc which were with him, and all the peopl from the least even
to the greatest, 42:9 and said unto them, thu saith the lord, the god
of israel, unto whom ye sent me to present your supplic before
him; 42:10 If ye will still abid in thi land, then will I build you,
and not pull you down, and I will plant you, and not pluck you up: for
i repent me of the evil that I have done unto you.

42:11 Be not afraid of the king of babylon, of whom ye are afraid; be
not afraid of him, saith the lord: for I am with you to save you, and
to deliv you from hi hand.

42:12 and I will shew merci unto you, that he may have merci upon
you, and caus you to return to your own land.

42:13 but if ye say, We will not dwell in thi land, neither obey the
voic of the lord your god, 42:14 saying, no; but we will go into the
land of egypt, where we shall see no war, nor hear the sound of the
trumpet, nor have hunger of bread; and there will we dwell: 42:15 and
now therefor hear the word of the lord, ye remnant of judah; thus
saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; If ye wholli set your
fac to enter into egypt, and go to sojourn there; 42:16 then it
shal come to pass, that the sword, which ye feared, shall overtake
y there in the land of egypt, and the famine, whereof ye were
afraid, shall follow close after you there in egypt; and there ye
shal die.

42:17 So shall it be with all the men that set their face to go into
egypt to sojourn there; they shall die by the sword, by the famine,
and by the pestilence: and none of them shall remain or escap from
th evil that I will bring upon them.

42:18 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; As mine
ang and my furi hath been pour forth upon the inhabit of
jerusalem; so shall my furi be pour forth upon you, when ye shall
ent into egypt: and ye shall be an execration, and an astonishment,
and a curse, and a reproach; and ye shall see thi place no more.

42:19 the lord hath said concern you, O ye remnant of judah; Go ye
not into egypt: know certainli that I have admonish you thi day.

42:20 for ye dissembl in your hearts, when ye sent me unto the lord
your god, saying, pray for us unto the lord our god; and according
unto all that the lord our god shall say, so declar unto us, and we
wil do it.

42:21 and now I have thi day declar it to you; but ye have not
obey the voic of the lord your god, nor ani thing for the which he
hath sent me unto you.

42:22 now therefor know certainli that ye shall die by the sword, by
th famine, and by the pestilence, in the place whither ye desir to
go and to sojourn.

43:1 and it came to pass, that when jeremiah had made an end of
speak unto all the peopl all the word of the lord their god, for
which the lord their god had sent him to them, even all these words,
43:2 then spake azariah the son of hoshaiah, and johanan the son of
kareah, and all the proud men, say unto jeremiah, thou speakest
falsely: the lord our god hath not sent thee to say, Go not into egypt
to sojourn there: 43:3 but baruch the son of neriah setteth thee on
against us, for to deliv us into the hand of the chaldeans, that
they might put us to death, and carri us away captiv into babylon.

43:4 So johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the forces,
and all the people, obey not the voic of the lord, to dwell in the
land of judah.

43:5 but johanan the son of kareah, and all the captain of the
forces, took all the remnant of judah, that were return from all
nations, whither they had been driven, to dwell in the land of judah;
43:6 even men, and women, and children, and the king' daughters, and
everi person that nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had left with
gedaliah the son of ahikam the son of shaphan, and jeremiah the
prophet, and baruch the son of neriah.

43:7 So they came into the land of egypt: for they obey not the
voic of the lord: thu came they even to tahpanhes.

43:8 then came the word of the lord unto jeremiah in tahpanhes,
saying, 43:9 take great stone in thine hand, and hide them in the
clay in the brickkiln, which is at the entri of pharaoh' hous in
tahpanhes, in the sight of the men of judah; 43:10 and say unto them,
thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; behold, I will send
and take nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon, my servant, and will set
hi throne upon these stone that I have hid; and he shall spread his
roy pavilion over them.

43:11 and when he cometh, he shall smite the land of egypt, and
deliv such as are for death to death; and such as are for captivity
to captivity; and such as are for the sword to the sword.

43:12 and I will kindl a fire in the hous of the god of egypt; and
h shall burn them, and carri them away captives: and he shall array
himself with the land of egypt, as a shepherd putteth on hi garment;
and he shall go forth from thenc in peace.

43:13 He shall break also the imag of bethshemesh, that is in the
land of egypt; and the hous of the god of the egyptian shall he
burn with fire.

44:1 the word that came to jeremiah concern all the jew which
dwel in the land of egypt, which dwell at migdol, and at tahpanhes,
and at noph, and in the countri of pathros, saying, 44:2 thu saith
th lord of hosts, the god of israel; Ye have seen all the evil that i
hav brought upon jerusalem, and upon all the citi of judah; and,
behold, thi day they are a desolation, and no man dwelleth therein,
44:3 becaus of their wicked which they have commit to provoke
m to anger, in that they went to burn incense, and to serv other
gods, whom they knew not, neither they, ye, nor your fathers.

44:4 howbeit I sent unto you all my servant the prophets, rising
earli and send them, saying, oh, do not thi abomin thing that
i hate.

44:5 but they hearken not, nor inclin their ear to turn from their
wickedness, to burn no incens unto other gods.

44:6 wherefor my furi and mine anger wa pour forth, and was
kindl in the citi of judah and in the street of jerusalem; and
they are wast and desolate, as at thi day.

44:7 therefor now thu saith the lord, the god of hosts, the god of
israel; wherefor commit ye thi great evil against your souls, to cut
off from you man and woman, child and suckling, out of judah, to leave
y none to remain; 44:8 In that ye provok me unto wrath with the
work of your hands, burn incens unto other god in the land of
egypt, whither ye be gone to dwell, that ye might cut yourselv off,
and that ye might be a curs and a reproach among all the nation of
th earth?  44:9 have ye forgotten the wicked of your fathers, and
th wicked of the king of judah, and the wicked of their
wives, and your own wickedness, and the wicked of your wives,
which they have commit in the land of judah, and in the street of
jerusalem?  44:10 they are not humbl even unto thi day, neither
hav they feared, nor walk in my law, nor in my statutes, that I set
befor you and befor your fathers.

44:11 therefor thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel;
behold, I will set my face against you for evil, and to cut off all
judah.

44:12 and I will take the remnant of judah, that have set their faces
to go into the land of egypt to sojourn there, and they shall all be
consumed, and fall in the land of egypt; they shall even be consumed
bi the sword and by the famine: they shall die, from the least even
unto the greatest, by the sword and by the famine: and they shall be
an execration, and an astonishment, and a curse, and a reproach.

44:13 for I will punish them that dwell in the land of egypt, as i
hav punish jerusalem, by the sword, by the famine, and by the
pestilence: 44:14 So that none of the remnant of judah, which are gone
into the land of egypt to sojourn there, shall escap or remain, that
they should return into the land of judah, to the which they have a
desir to return to dwell there: for none shall return but such as
shal escape.

44:15 then all the men which knew that their wive had burn incense
unto other gods, and all the women that stood by, a great multitude,
even all the peopl that dwelt in the land of egypt, in pathros,
answ jeremiah, saying, 44:16 As for the word that thou hast spoken
unto us in the name of the lord, we will not hearken unto thee.

44:17 but we will certainli do whatsoev thing goeth forth out of our
own mouth, to burn incens unto the queen of heaven, and to pour out
drink offer unto her, as we have done, we, and our fathers, our
kings, and our princes, in the citi of judah, and in the street of
jerusalem: for then had we plenti of victuals, and were well, and saw
no evil.

44:18 but sinc we left off to burn incens to the queen of heaven,
and to pour out drink offer unto her, we have want all things,
and have been consum by the sword and by the famine.

44:19 and when we burn incens to the queen of heaven, and poured
out drink offer unto her, did we make her cake to worship her,
and pour out drink offer unto her, without our men?  44:20 then
jeremiah said unto all the people, to the men, and to the women, and
to all the peopl which had given him that answer, saying, 44:21 the
incens that ye burn in the citi of judah, and in the street of
jerusalem, ye, and your fathers, your kings, and your princes, and the
peopl of the land, did not the lord rememb them, and came it not
into hi mind?  44:22 So that the lord could no longer bear, because
of the evil of your doings, and becaus of the abomin which ye
hav committed; therefor is your land a desolation, and an
astonishment, and a curse, without an inhabitant, as at thi day.

44:23 becaus ye have burn incense, and becaus ye have sinned
against the lord, and have not obey the voic of the lord, nor
walk in hi law, nor in hi statutes, nor in hi testimonies;
therefor thi evil is happen unto you, as at thi day.

44:24 moreov jeremiah said unto all the people, and to all the
women, hear the word of the lord, all judah that are in the land of
egypt: 44:25 thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel, saying;
y and your wive have both spoken with your mouths, and fulfilled
with your hand, saying, We will sure perform our vow that we have
vowed, to burn incens to the queen of heaven, and to pour out drink
off unto her: ye will sure accomplish your vows, and surely
perform your vows.

44:26 therefor hear ye the word of the lord, all judah that dwell in
th land of egypt; behold, I have sworn by my great name, saith the
lord, that my name shall no more be name in the mouth of ani man of
judah in all the land of egypt, saying, the lord god liveth.

44:27 behold, I will watch over them for evil, and not for good: and
al the men of judah that are in the land of egypt shall be consumed
bi the sword and by the famine, until there be an end of them.

44:28 yet a small number that escap the sword shall return out of the
land of egypt into the land of judah, and all the remnant of judah,
that are gone into the land of egypt to sojourn there, shall know
whos word shall stand, mine, or their's.

44:29 and thi shall be a sign unto you, saith the lord, that I will
punish you in thi place, that ye may know that my word shall surely
stand against you for evil: 44:30 thu saith the lord; behold, I will
giv pharaohhophra king of egypt into the hand of hi enemies, and
into the hand of them that seek hi life; as I gave zedekiah king of
judah into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, hi enemy, and
that sought hi life.

45:1 the word that jeremiah the prophet spake unto baruch the son of
neriah, when he had written these word in a book at the mouth of
jeremiah, in the fourth year of jehoiakim the son of josiah king of
judah, saying, 45:2 thu saith the lord, the god of israel, unto thee,
o baruch: 45:3 thou didst say, woe is me now! for the lord hath added
grief to my sorrow; I faint in my sighing, and I find no rest.

45:4 thu shalt thou say unto him, the lord saith thus; behold, that
which I have built will I break down, and that which I have plant i
wil pluck up, even thi whole land.

45:5 and seekest thou great thing for thyself? seek them not: for,
behold, I will bring evil upon all flesh, saith the lord: but thi life
wil I give unto thee for a prey in all place whither thou goest.

46:1 the word of the lord which came to jeremiah the prophet against
th gentiles; 46:2 against egypt, against the armi of pharaohnecho
k of egypt, which wa by the river euphrat in carchemish, which
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon smote in the fourth year of jehoiakim
th son of josiah king of judah.

46:3 order ye the buckler and shield, and draw near to battle.

46:4 har the horses; and get up, ye horsemen, and stand forth with
your helmets; furbish the spears, and put on the brigandines.

46:5 wherefor have I seen them dismay and turn away back? and
their mighti one are beaten down, and are fled apace, and look not
back: for fear wa round about, saith the lord.

46:6 let not the swift flee away, nor the mighti man escape; they
shal stumble, and fall toward the north by the river euphrates.

46:7 who is thi that cometh up as a flood, whose water are move as
th rivers?  46:8 egypt riseth up like a flood, and hi water are
mov like the rivers; and he saith, I will go up, and will cover the
earth; I will destroy the citi and the inhabit thereof.

46:9 come up, ye horses; and rage, ye chariots; and let the mighti men
com forth; the ethiopian and the libyans, that handl the shield;
and the lydians, that handl and bend the bow.

46:10 for thi is the day of the lord god of hosts, a day of
vengeance, that he may aveng him of hi adversaries: and the sword
shal devour, and it shall be satiat and made drunk with their blood:
for the lord god of host hath a sacrific in the north countri by the
riv euphrates.

46:11 Go up into gilead, and take balm, O virgin, the daughter of
egypt: in vain shalt thou use mani medicines; for thou shalt not be
cured.

46:12 the nation have heard of thi shame, and thi cri hath fill the
land: for the mighti man hath stumbl against the mighty, and they
ar fallen both together.

46:13 the word that the lord spake to jeremiah the prophet, how
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon should come and smite the land of
egypt.

46:14 declar ye in egypt, and publish in migdol, and publish in noph
and in tahpanhes: say ye, stand fast, and prepar thee; for the sword
shal devour round about thee.

46:15 whi are thi valiant men swept away? they stood not, becaus the
lord did drive them.

46:16 He made mani to fall, yea, one fell upon another: and they said,
arise, and let us go again to our own people, and to the land of our
nativity, from the oppress sword.

46:17 they did cri there, pharaoh king of egypt is but a noise; he
hath pass the time appointed.

46:18 As I live, saith the king, whose name is the lord of hosts,
sur as tabor is among the mountains, and as carmel by the sea, so
shal he come.

46:19 O thou daughter dwell in egypt, furnish thyself to go into
captivity: for noph shall be wast and desol without an inhabitant.

46:20 egypt is like a veri fair heifer, but destruct cometh; it
cometh out of the north.

46:21 also her hire men are in the midst of her like fat bullocks;
for they also are turn back, and are fled away together: they did
not stand, becaus the day of their calam wa come upon them, and
th time of their visitation.

46:22 the voic thereof shall go like a serpent; for they shall march
with an army, and come against her with axes, as hewer of wood.

46:23 they shall cut down her forest, saith the lord, though it cannot
b searched; becaus they are more than the grasshoppers, and are
innumerable.

46:24 the daughter of egypt shall be confounded; she shall be
deliv into the hand of the peopl of the north.

46:25 the lord of hosts, the god of israel, saith; behold, I will
punish the multitud of no, and pharaoh, and egypt, with their gods,
and their kings; even pharaoh, and all them that trust in him: 46:26
and I will deliv them into the hand of those that seek their lives,
and into the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, and into the hand
of hi servants: and afterward it shall be inhabited, as in the days
of old, saith the lord.

46:27 but fear not thou, O my servant jacob, and be not dismayed, o
israel: for, behold, I will save thee from afar off, and thi seed from
th land of their captivity; and jacob shall return, and be in rest
and at ease, and none shall make him afraid.

46:28 fear thou not, O jacob my servant, saith the lord: for I am with
thee; for I will make a full end of all the nation whither I have
driven thee: but I will not make a full end of thee, but correct thee
in measure; yet will I not leav thee wholli unpunished.

47:1 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah the prophet against
th philistines, befor that pharaoh smote gaza.

47:2 thu saith the lord; behold, water rise up out of the north, and
shal be an overflow flood, and shall overflow the land, and all
that is therein; the city, and them that dwell therein: then the men
shal cry, and all the inhabit of the land shall howl.

47:3 At the nois of the stamp of the hoof of hi strong horses,
at the rush of hi chariots, and at the rumbl of hi wheels, the
fath shall not look back to their children for feebl of hands;
47:4 becaus of the day that cometh to spoil all the philistines, and
to cut off from tyru and zidon everi helper that remaineth: for the
lord will spoil the philistines, the remnant of the countri of
caphtor.

47:5 bald is come upon gaza; ashkelon is cut off with the remnant
of their valley: how long wilt thou cut thyself?  47:6 O thou sword of
th lord, how long will it be ere thou be quiet? put up thyself into
thi scabbard, rest, and be still.

47:7 how can it be quiet, see the lord hath given it a charge
against ashkelon, and against the sea shore? there hath he appointed
it.

48:1 against moab thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; woe
unto nebo! for it is spoiled: kiriathaim is confound and taken:
misgab is confound and dismayed.

48:2 there shall be no more prais of moab: in heshbon they have
devis evil against it; come, and let us cut it off from be a
nation. also thou shalt be cut down, O madmen; the sword shall pursue
thee.

48:3 A voic of cri shall be from horonaim, spoil and great
destruction.

48:4 moab is destroyed; her littl one have caus a cri to be heard.

48:5 for in the go up of luhith continu weep shall go up; for
in the go down of horonaim the enemi have heard a cri of
destruction.

48:6 flee, save your lives, and be like the heath in the wilderness.

48:7 for becaus thou hast trust in thi work and in thi treasures,
th shalt also be taken: and chemosh shall go forth into captivity
with hi priest and hi princ together.

48:8 and the spoiler shall come upon everi city, and no citi shall
escape: the valley also shall perish, and the plain shall be
destroyed, as the lord hath spoken.

48:9 give wing unto moab, that it may flee and get away: for the
citi thereof shall be desolate, without ani to dwell therein.

48:10 curs be he that doeth the work of the lord deceitfully, and
curs be he that keepeth back hi sword from blood.

48:11 moab hath been at eas from hi youth, and he hath settl on
hi lees, and hath not been empti from vessel to vessel, neither
hath he gone into captivity: therefor hi tast remain in him, and
hi scent is not changed.

48:12 therefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will
send unto him wanderers, that shall caus him to wander, and shall
empti hi vessels, and break their bottles.

48:13 and moab shall be asham of chemosh, as the hous of israel was
asham of bethel their confidence.

48:14 how say ye, We are mighti and strong men for the war?  48:15
moab is spoiled, and gone up out of her cities, and hi chosen young
men are gone down to the slaughter, saith the king, whose name is the
lord of hosts.

48:16 the calam of moab is near to come, and hi afflict hasteth
fast.

48:17 all ye that are about him, bemoan him; and all ye that know his
name, say, how is the strong staff broken, and the beauti rod!
48:18 thou daughter that dost inhabit dibon, come down from thi glory,
and sit in thirst; for the spoiler of moab shall come upon thee, and
h shall destroy thi strong holds.

48:19 O inhabit of aroer, stand by the way, and espy; ask him that
fleeth, and her that escapeth, and say, what is done?  48:20 moab is
confounded; for it is broken down: howl and cry; tell ye it in arnon,
that moab is spoiled, 48:21 and judgment is come upon the plain
country; upon holon, and upon jahazah, and upon mephaath, 48:22 and
upon dibon, and upon nebo, and upon bethdiblathaim, 48:23 and upon
kiriathaim, and upon bethgamul, and upon bethmeon, 48:24 and upon
kerioth, and upon bozrah, and upon all the citi of the land of moab,
far or near.

48:25 the horn of moab is cut off, and hi arm is broken, saith the
lord.

48:26 make ye him drunken: for he magnifi himself against the lord:
moab also shall wallow in hi vomit, and he also shall be in derision.

48:27 for wa not israel a deris unto thee? wa he found among
thieves?  for sinc thou spakest of him, thou skippedst for joy.

48:28 O ye that dwell in moab, leav the cities, and dwell in the
rock, and be like the dove that maketh her nest in the side of the
hole' mouth.

48:29 We have heard the pride of moab, (he is exceed proud) his
loftiness, and hi arrogancy, and hi pride, and the haughti of
hi heart.

48:30 I know hi wrath, saith the lord; but it shall not be so; his
li shall not so effect it.

48:31 therefor will I howl for moab, and I will cri out for all moab;
min heart shall mourn for the men of kirheres.

48:32 O vine of sibmah, I will weep for thee with the weep of
jazer: thi plant are gone over the sea, they reach even to the sea of
jazer: the spoiler is fallen upon thi summer fruit and upon thy
vintage.

48:33 and joy and glad is taken from the plenti field, and from
th land of moab, and I have caus wine to fail from the winepresses:
non shall tread with shouting; their shout shall be no shouting.

48:34 from the cri of heshbon even unto elealeh, and even unto jahaz,
hav they utter their voice, from zoar even unto horonaim, as an
heif of three year old: for the water also of nimrim shall be
desolate.

48:35 moreov I will caus to ceas in moab, saith the lord, him that
offereth in the high places, and him that burneth incens to hi gods.

48:36 therefor mine heart shall sound for moab like pipes, and mine
heart shall sound like pipe for the men of kirheres: becaus the
rich that he hath gotten are perished.

48:37 for everi head shall be bald, and everi beard clipped: upon all
th hand shall be cuttings, and upon the loin sackcloth.

48:38 there shall be lament gener upon all the housetop of
moab, and in the street thereof: for I have broken moab like a vessel
wherein is no pleasure, saith the lord.

48:39 they shall howl, saying, how is it broken down! how hath moab
turn the back with shame! so shall moab be a deris and a
dismay to all them about him.

48:40 for thu saith the lord; behold, he shall fli as an eagle, and
shal spread hi wing over moab.

48:41 kerioth is taken, and the strong hold are surprised, and the
mighti men' heart in moab at that day shall be as the heart of a
woman in her pangs.

48:42 and moab shall be destroy from be a people, becaus he hath
magnifi himself against the lord.

48:43 fear, and the pit, and the snare, shall be upon thee, o
inhabit of moab, saith the lord.

48:44 He that fleeth from the fear shall fall into the pit; and he
that getteth up out of the pit shall be taken in the snare: for I will
br upon it, even upon moab, the year of their visitation, saith the
lord.

48:45 they that fled stood under the shadow of heshbon becaus of the
force: but a fire shall come forth out of heshbon, and a flame from
th midst of sihon, and shall devour the corner of moab, and the crown
of the head of the tumultu ones.

48:46 woe be unto thee, O moab! the peopl of chemosh perisheth: for
thi son are taken captives, and thi daughter captives.

48:47 yet will I bring again the captiv of moab in the latter days,
saith the lord. thu far is the judgment of moab.

49:1 concern the ammonites, thu saith the lord; hath israel no
sons?  hath he no heir? whi then doth their king inherit gad, and his
peopl dwell in hi cities?  49:2 therefore, behold, the day come,
saith the lord, that I will caus an alarm of war to be heard in
rabbah of the ammonites; and it shall be a desol heap, and her
daught shall be burn with fire: then shall israel be heir unto
them that were hi heirs, saith the lord.

49:3 howl, O heshbon, for Ai is spoiled: cry, ye daughter of rabbah,
gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro by the hedges; for
their king shall go into captivity, and hi priest and hi princes
together.

49:4 wherefor gloriest thou in the valleys, thi flow valley, o
backslid daughter? that trust in her treasures, saying, who shall
com unto me?  49:5 behold, I will bring a fear upon thee, saith the
lord god of hosts, from all those that be about thee; and ye shall be
driven out everi man right forth; and none shall gather up him that
wandereth.

49:6 and afterward I will bring again the captiv of the children of
ammon, saith the lord.

49:7 concern edom, thu saith the lord of hosts; Is wisdom no more
in teman? is counsel perish from the prudent? is their wisdom
vanished?  49:8 flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabit of
dedan; for I will bring the calam of esau upon him, the time that i
wil visit him.

49:9 If grapegather come to thee, would they not leav some
glean grapes? if thiev by night, they will destroy till they have
enough.

49:10 but I have made esau bare, I have uncov hi secret places,
and he shall not be abl to hide himself: hi seed is spoiled, and his
brethren, and hi neighbours, and he is not.

49:11 leav thi fatherless children, I will preserv them alive; and
let thi widow trust in me.

49:12 for thu saith the lord; behold, they whose judgment wa not to
drink of the cup have assuredli drunken; and art thou he that shall
altogeth go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt
sur drink of it.

49:13 for I have sworn by myself, saith the lord, that bozrah shall
becom a desolation, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the
citi thereof shall be perpetu wastes.

49:14 I have heard a rumour from the lord, and an ambassador is sent
unto the heathen, saying, gather ye together, and come against her,
and rise up to the battle.

49:15 for, lo, I will make thee small among the heathen, and despised
among men.

49:16 thi terribl hath deceiv thee, and the pride of thine
heart, O thou that dwellest in the cleft of the rock, that holdest
th height of the hill: though thou shouldest make thi nest as high as
th eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the lord.

49:17 also edom shall be a desolation: everi one that goeth by it
shal be astonished, and shall hiss at all the plagu thereof.

49:18 As in the overthrow of sodom and gomorrah and the neighbour
c thereof, saith the lord, no man shall abid there, neither
shal a son of man dwell in it.

49:19 behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swell of jordan
against the habit of the strong: but I will suddenli make him run
away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her?
for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that
shepherd that will stand befor me?  49:20 therefor hear the counsel
of the lord, that he hath taken against edom; and hi purposes, that
h hath purpos against the inhabit of teman: sure the least of
th flock shall draw them out: sure he shall make their habitations
desol with them.

49:21 the earth is move at the nois of their fall, at the cri the
nois thereof wa heard in the red sea.

49:22 behold, he shall come up and fli as the eagle, and spread his
w over bozrah: and at that day shall the heart of the mighti men
of edom be as the heart of a woman in her pangs.

49:23 concern damascus. hamath is confounded, and arpad: for they
hav heard evil tidings: they are fainthearted; there is sorrow on the
sea; it cannot be quiet.

49:24 damascu is wax feeble, and turneth herself to flee, and fear
hath seiz on her: anguish and sorrow have taken her, as a woman in
travail.

49:25 how is the citi of prais not left, the citi of my joy!  49:26
therefor her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of
war shall be cut off in that day, saith the lord of hosts.

49:27 and I will kindl a fire in the wall of damascus, and it shall
consum the palac of benhadad.

49:28 concern kedar, and concern the kingdom of hazor, which
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon shall smite, thu saith the lord; arise
ye, go up to kedar, and spoil the men of the east.

49:29 their tent and their flock shall they take away: they shall
tak to themselv their curtains, and all their vessels, and their
camels; and they shall cri unto them, fear is on everi side.

49:30 flee, get you far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabit of hazor,
saith the lord; for nebuchadrezzar king of babylon hath taken counsel
against you, and hath conceiv a purpos against you.

49:31 arise, get you up unto the wealthi nation, that dwelleth without
care, saith the lord, which have neither gate nor bars, which dwell
alone.

49:32 and their camel shall be a booty, and the multitud of their
cattl a spoil: and I will scatter into all wind them that are in the
utmost corners; and I will bring their calam from all sides
thereof, saith the lord.

49:33 and hazor shall be a dwell for dragons, and a desol for
ever: there shall no man abid there, nor ani son of man dwell in it.

49:34 the word of the lord that came to jeremiah the prophet against
elam in the begin of the reign of zedekiah king of judah, saying,
49:35 thu saith the lord of hosts; behold, I will break the bow of
elam, the chief of their might.

49:36 and upon elam will I bring the four wind from the four quarters
of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there
shal be no nation whither the outcast of elam shall not come.

49:37 for I will caus elam to be dismay befor their enemies, and
befor them that seek their life: and I will bring evil upon them,
even my fierc anger, saith the lord; and I will send the sword after
them, till I have consum them: 49:38 and I will set my throne in
elam, and will destroy from thenc the king and the princes, saith the
lord.

49:39 but it shall come to pass in the latter days, that I will bring
again the captiv of elam, saith the lord.

50:1 the word that the lord spake against babylon and against the land
of the chaldean by jeremiah the prophet.

50:2 declar ye among the nations, and publish, and set up a standard;
publish, and conceal not: say, babylon is taken, bel is confounded,
merodach is broken in pieces; her idol are confounded, her imag are
broken in pieces.

50:3 for out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which
shal make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they shall
remove, they shall depart, both man and beast.

50:4 In those days, and in that time, saith the lord, the children of
israel shall come, they and the children of judah together, go and
weeping: they shall go, and seek the lord their god.

50:5 they shall ask the way to zion with their face thitherward,
saying, come, and let us join ourselv to the lord in a perpetual
coven that shall not be forgotten.

50:6 My peopl hath been lost sheep: their shepherd have caus them
to go astray, they have turn them away on the mountains: they have
gon from mountain to hill, they have forgotten their restingplace.

50:7 all that found them have devour them: and their adversaries
said, We offend not, becaus they have sin against the lord, the
habit of justice, even the lord, the hope of their fathers.

50:8 remov out of the midst of babylon, and go forth out of the land
of the chaldeans, and be as the he goat befor the flocks.

50:9 for, lo, I will rais and caus to come up against babylon an
assembl of great nation from the north country: and they shall set
themselv in array against her; from thenc she shall be taken: their
arrow shall be as of a mighti expert man; none shall return in vain.

50:10 and chaldea shall be a spoil: all that spoil her shall be
satisfied, saith the lord.

50:11 becaus ye were glad, becaus ye rejoiced, O ye destroy of
min heritage, becaus ye are grown fat as the heifer at grass, and
bellow as bulls; 50:12 your mother shall be sore confounded; she that
bar you shall be ashamed: behold, the hindermost of the nation shall
b a wilderness, a dri land, and a desert.

50:13 becaus of the wrath of the lord it shall not be inhabited, but
it shall be wholli desolate: everi one that goeth by babylon shall be
astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.

50:14 put yourselv in array against babylon round about: all ye that
bend the bow, shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned
against the lord.

50:15 shout against her round about: she hath given her hand: her
found are fallen, her wall are thrown down: for it is the
veng of the lord: take vengeanc upon her; as she hath done, do
unto her.

50:16 cut off the sower from babylon, and him that handleth the sickle
in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppress sword they shall
turn everi one to hi people, and they shall flee everi one to hi own
land.

50:17 israel is a scatter sheep; the lion have driven him away:
first the king of assyria hath devour him; and last this
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon hath broken hi bones.

50:18 therefor thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel;
behold, I will punish the king of babylon and hi land, as I have
punish the king of assyria.

50:19 and I will bring israel again to hi habitation, and he shall
fe on carmel and bashan, and hi soul shall be satisfi upon mount
ephraim and gilead.

50:20 In those days, and in that time, saith the lord, the iniqu of
israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sin of
judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom i
reserve.

50:21 Go up against the land of merathaim, even against it, and
against the inhabit of pekod: wast and utterli destroy after
them, saith the lord, and do accord to all that I have commanded
thee.

50:22 A sound of battl is in the land, and of great destruction.

50:23 how is the hammer of the whole earth cut asund and broken! how
i babylon becom a desol among the nations!  50:24 I have laid a
snar for thee, and thou art also taken, O babylon, and thou wast not
aware: thou art found, and also caught, becaus thou hast striven
against the lord.

50:25 the lord hath open hi armoury, and hath brought forth the
weapon of hi indignation: for thi is the work of the lord god of
host in the land of the chaldeans.

50:26 come against her from the utmost border, open her storehouses:
cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly: let noth of her be
left.

50:27 slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe
unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.

50:28 the voic of them that flee and escap out of the land of
babylon, to declar in zion the vengeanc of the lord our god, the
veng of hi temple.

50:29 call togeth the archer against babylon: all ye that bend the
bow, camp against it round about; let none thereof escape: recompense
h accord to her work; accord to all that she hath done, do
unto her: for she hath been proud against the lord, against the holy
on of israel.

50:30 therefor shall her young men fall in the streets, and all her
men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the lord.

50:31 behold, I am against thee, O thou most proud, saith the lord god
of hosts: for thi day is come, the time that I will visit thee.

50:32 and the most proud shall stumbl and fall, and none shall raise
him up: and I will kindl a fire in hi cities, and it shall devour
al round about him.

50:33 thu saith the lord of hosts; the children of israel and the
children of judah were oppress together: and all that took them
capt held them fast; they refus to let them go.

50:34 their redeem is strong; the lord of host is hi name: he
shal throughli plead their cause, that he may give rest to the land,
and disquiet the inhabit of babylon.

50:35 A sword is upon the chaldeans, saith the lord, and upon the
inhabit of babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.

50:36 A sword is upon the liars; and they shall dote: a sword is upon
h mighti men; and they shall be dismayed.

50:37 A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon
al the mingl peopl that are in the midst of her; and they shall
becom as women: a sword is upon her treasures; and they shall be
robbed.

50:38 A drought is upon her waters; and they shall be dri up: for it
i the land of graven images, and they are mad upon their idols.

50:39 therefor the wild beast of the desert with the wild beast of
th island shall dwell there, and the owl shall dwell therein: and
it shall be no more inhabit for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in
from gener to generation.

50:40 As god overthrew sodom and gomorrah and the neighbour cities
thereof, saith the lord; so shall no man abid there, neither shall
ani son of man dwell therein.

50:41 behold, a peopl shall come from the north, and a great nation,
and mani king shall be rais up from the coast of the earth.

50:42 they shall hold the bow and the lance: they are cruel, and will
not shew mercy: their voic shall roar like the sea, and they shall
rid upon horses, everi one put in array, like a man to the battle,
against thee, O daughter of babylon.

50:43 the king of babylon hath heard the report of them, and hi hands
wax feeble: anguish took hold of him, and pang as of a woman in
travail.

50:44 behold, he shall come up like a lion from the swell of jordan
unto the habit of the strong: but I will make them suddenli run
away from her: and who is a chosen man, that I may appoint over her?
for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that
shepherd that will stand befor me?  50:45 therefor hear ye the
counsel of the lord, that he hath taken against babylon; and his
purposes, that he hath purpos against the land of the chaldeans:
sur the least of the flock shall draw them out: sure he shall
mak their habit desol with them.

50:46 At the nois of the take of babylon the earth is moved, and
th cri is heard among the nations.

51:1 thu saith the lord; behold, I will rais up against babylon, and
against them that dwell in the midst of them that rise up against me,
a destroy wind; 51:2 and will send unto babylon fanners, that shall
fan her, and shall empti her land: for in the day of troubl they
shal be against her round about.

51:3 against him that bendeth let the archer bend hi bow, and against
him that lifteth himself up in hi brigandine: and spare ye not her
young men; destroy ye utterli all her host.

51:4 thu the slain shall fall in the land of the chaldeans, and they
that are thrust through in her streets.

51:5 for israel hath not been forsaken, nor judah of hi god, of the
lord of hosts; though their land wa fill with sin against the holy
on of israel.

51:6 flee out of the midst of babylon, and deliv everi man hi soul:
b not cut off in her iniquity; for thi is the time of the lord's
vengeance; he will render unto her a recompence.

51:7 babylon hath been a golden cup in the lord' hand, that made all
th earth drunken: the nation have drunken of her wine; therefor the
nat are mad.

51:8 babylon is suddenli fallen and destroyed: howl for her; take balm
for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

51:9 We would have heal babylon, but she is not healed: forsak her,
and let us go everi one into hi own country: for her judgment
reacheth unto heaven, and is lift up even to the skies.

51:10 the lord hath brought forth our righteousness: come, and let us
declar in zion the work of the lord our god.

51:11 make bright the arrows; gather the shields: the lord hath raised
up the spirit of the king of the medes: for hi devic is against
babylon, to destroy it; becaus it is the vengeanc of the lord, the
veng of hi temple.

51:12 set up the standard upon the wall of babylon, make the watch
strong, set up the watchmen, prepar the ambushes: for the lord hath
both devis and done that which he spake against the inhabit of
babylon.

51:13 O thou that dwellest upon mani waters, abund in treasures,
thin end is come, and the measur of thi covetousness.

51:14 the lord of host hath sworn by himself, saying, sure I will
fil thee with men, as with caterpillers; and they shall lift up a
shout against thee.

51:15 He hath made the earth by hi power, he hath establish the
world by hi wisdom, and hath stretch out the heaven by his
understanding.

51:16 when he uttereth hi voice, there is a multitud of water in
th heavens; and he causeth the vapour to ascend from the end of the
earth: he maketh lightn with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out
of hi treasures.

51:17 everi man is brutish by hi knowledge; everi founder is
confound by the graven image: for hi molten imag is falsehood, and
ther is no breath in them.

51:18 they are vanity, the work of errors: in the time of their
visit they shall perish.

51:19 the portion of jacob is not like them; for he is the former of
al things: and israel is the rod of hi inheritance: the lord of
host is hi name.

51:20 thou art my battl axe and weapon of war: for with thee will i
break in piec the nations, and with thee will I destroy kingdoms;
51:21 and with thee will I break in piec the hors and hi rider;
and with thee will I break in piec the chariot and hi rider; 51:22
with thee also will I break in piec man and woman; and with thee
wil I break in piec old and young; and with thee will I break in
piec the young man and the maid; 51:23 I will also break in pieces
with thee the shepherd and hi flock; and with thee will I break in
piec the husbandman and hi yoke of oxen; and with thee will I break
in piec captain and rulers.

51:24 and I will render unto babylon and to all the inhabit of
chaldea all their evil that they have done in zion in your sight,
saith the lord.

51:25 behold, I am against thee, O destroy mountain, saith the
lord, which destroyest all the earth: and I will stretch out mine hand
upon thee, and roll thee down from the rocks, and will make thee a
burnt mountain.

51:26 and they shall not take of thee a stone for a corner, nor a
ston for foundations; but thou shalt be desol for ever, saith the
lord.

51:27 set ye up a standard in the land, blow the trumpet among the
nations, prepar the nation against her, call togeth against her
th kingdom of ararat, minni, and ashchenaz; appoint a captain
against her; caus the hors to come up as the rough caterpillers.

51:28 prepar against her the nation with the king of the medes, the
captain thereof, and all the ruler thereof, and all the land of his
dominion.

51:29 and the land shall trembl and sorrow: for everi purpos of the
lord shall be perform against babylon, to make the land of babylon a
desol without an inhabitant.

51:30 the mighti men of babylon have forborn to fight, they have
remain in their holds: their might hath failed; they becam as
women: they have burn her dwellingplaces; her bar are broken.

51:31 one post shall run to meet another, and one messeng to meet
another, to shew the king of babylon that hi citi is taken at one
end, 51:32 and that the passag are stopped, and the reed they have
burn with fire, and the men of war are affrighted.

51:33 for thu saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel; the
daught of babylon is like a threshingfloor, it is time to thresh
her: yet a littl while, and the time of her harvest shall come.

51:34 nebuchadrezzar the king of babylon hath devour me, he hath
crush me, he hath made me an empti vessel, he hath swallow me up
lik a dragon, he hath fill hi belli with my delicates, he hath
cast me out.

51:35 the violenc done to me and to my flesh be upon babylon, shall
th inhabit of zion say; and my blood upon the inhabit of
chaldea, shall jerusalem say.

51:36 therefor thu saith the lord; behold, I will plead thi cause,
and take vengeanc for thee; and I will dri up her sea, and make her
spr dry.

51:37 and babylon shall becom heaps, a dwellingplac for dragons, an
astonishment, and an hissing, without an inhabitant.

51:38 they shall roar togeth like lions: they shall yell as lions'
whelps.

51:39 In their heat I will make their feasts, and I will make them
drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetu sleep, and not
wake, saith the lord.

51:40 I will bring them down like lamb to the slaughter, like rams
with he goats.

51:41 how is sheshach taken! and how is the prais of the whole earth
surprised! how is babylon becom an astonish among the nations!
51:42 the sea is come up upon babylon: she is cover with the
multitud of the wave thereof.

51:43 her citi are a desolation, a dri land, and a wilderness, a
land wherein no man dwelleth, neither doth ani son of man pass
thereby.

51:44 and I will punish bel in babylon, and I will bring forth out of
hi mouth that which he hath swallow up: and the nation shall not
flow togeth ani more unto him: yea, the wall of babylon shall fall.

51:45 My people, go ye out of the midst of her, and deliv ye every
man hi soul from the fierc anger of the lord.

51:46 and lest your heart faint, and ye fear for the rumour that shall
b heard in the land; a rumour shall both come one year, and after
that in anoth year shall come a rumour, and violenc in the land,
rul against ruler.

51:47 therefore, behold, the day come, that I will do judgment upon
th graven imag of babylon: and her whole land shall be confounded,
and all her slain shall fall in the midst of her.

51:48 then the heaven and the earth, and all that is therein, shall
s for babylon: for the spoiler shall come unto her from the north,
saith the lord.

51:49 As babylon hath caus the slain of israel to fall, so at
babylon shall fall the slain of all the earth.

51:50 Ye that have escap the sword, go away, stand not still:
rememb the lord afar off, and let jerusalem come into your mind.

51:51 We are confounded, becaus we have heard reproach: shame hath
cov our faces: for stranger are come into the sanctuari of the
lord' house.

51:52 wherefore, behold, the day come, saith the lord, that I will do
judg upon her graven images: and through all her land the wounded
shal groan.

51:53 though babylon should mount up to heaven, and though she should
fortifi the height of her strength, yet from me shall spoiler come
unto her, saith the lord.

51:54 A sound of a cri cometh from babylon, and great destruct from
th land of the chaldeans: 51:55 becaus the lord hath spoiled
babylon, and destroy out of her the great voice; when her wave do
roar like great waters, a nois of their voic is uttered: 51:56
becaus the spoiler is come upon her, even upon babylon, and her
mighti men are taken, everi one of their bow is broken: for the lord
god of recomp shall sure requite.

51:57 and I will make drunk her princes, and her wise men, her
captains, and her rulers, and her mighti men: and they shall sleep a
perpetu sleep, and not wake, saith the king, whose name is the lord
of hosts.

51:58 thu saith the lord of hosts; the broad wall of babylon shall
b utterli broken, and her high gate shall be burn with fire; and
th peopl shall labour in vain, and the folk in the fire, and they
shal be weary.

51:59 the word which jeremiah the prophet command seraiah the son of
neriah, the son of maaseiah, when he went with zedekiah the king of
judah into babylon in the fourth year of hi reign. and thi seraiah
wa a quiet prince.

51:60 So jeremiah wrote in a book all the evil that should come upon
babylon, even all these word that are written against babylon.

51:61 and jeremiah said to seraiah, when thou comest to babylon, and
shalt see, and shalt read all these words; 51:62 then shalt thou say,
o lord, thou hast spoken against thi place, to cut it off, that none
shal remain in it, neither man nor beast, but that it shall be
desol for ever.

51:63 and it shall be, when thou hast made an end of read this
book, that thou shalt bind a stone to it, and cast it into the midst
of euphrates: 51:64 and thou shalt say, thu shall babylon sink, and
shal not rise from the evil that I will bring upon her: and they
shal be weary. thu far are the word of jeremiah.

52:1 zedekiah wa one and twenti year old when he began to reign, and
h reign eleven year in jerusalem. and hi mother' name was
hamut the daughter of jeremiah of libnah.

52:2 and he did that which wa evil in the eye of the lord, according
to all that jehoiakim had done.

52:3 for through the anger of the lord it came to pass in jerusalem
and judah, till he had cast them out from hi presence, that zedekiah
rebel against the king of babylon.

52:4 and it came to pass in the ninth year of hi reign, in the tenth
month, in the tenth day of the month, that nebuchadrezzar king of
babylon came, he and all hi army, against jerusalem, and pitched
against it, and built fort against it round about.

52:5 So the citi wa besieg unto the eleventh year of king zedekiah.

52:6 and in the fourth month, in the ninth day of the month, the
famin wa sore in the city, so that there wa no bread for the people
of the land.

52:7 then the citi wa broken up, and all the men of war fled, and
went forth out of the citi by night by the way of the gate between the
two walls, which wa by the king' garden; (now the chaldean were by
th citi round about:) and they went by the way of the plain.

52:8 but the armi of the chaldean pursu after the king, and
overtook zedekiah in the plain of jericho; and all hi armi was
scatt from him.

52:9 then they took the king, and carri him up unto the king of
babylon to riblah in the land of hamath; where he gave judgment upon
him.

52:10 and the king of babylon slew the son of zedekiah befor his
eyes: he slew also all the princ of judah in riblah.

52:11 then he put out the eye of zedekiah; and the king of babylon
bound him in chains, and carri him to babylon, and put him in prison
til the day of hi death.

52:12 now in the fifth month, in the tenth day of the month, which was
th nineteenth year of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, came
nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, which serv the king of babylon,
into jerusalem, 52:13 and burn the hous of the lord, and the king's
house; and all the hous of jerusalem, and all the hous of the
great men, burn he with fire: 52:14 and all the armi of the
chaldeans, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down all the
wal of jerusalem round about.

52:15 then nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carri away captive
certain of the poor of the people, and the residu of the peopl that
remain in the city, and those that fell away, that fell to the king
of babylon, and the rest of the multitude.

52:16 but nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left certain of the
poor of the land for vinedress and for husbandmen.

52:17 also the pillar of brass that were in the hous of the lord,
and the bases, and the brasen sea that wa in the hous of the lord,
th chaldean brake, and carri all the brass of them to babylon.

52:18 the caldron also, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the
bowls, and the spoons, and all the vessel of brass wherewith they
ministered, took they away.

52:19 and the basons, and the firepans, and the bowls, and the
caldrons, and the candlesticks, and the spoons, and the cups; that
which wa of gold in gold, and that which wa of silver in silver,
took the captain of the guard away.

52:20 the two pillars, one sea, and twelv brasen bull that were
und the bases, which king solomon had made in the hous of the lord:
th brass of all these vessel wa without weight.

52:21 and concern the pillars, the height of one pillar was
eighteen cubits; and a fillet of twelv cubit did compass it; and the
thick thereof wa four fingers: it wa hollow.

52:22 and a chapit of brass wa upon it; and the height of one
chapit wa five cubits, with network and pomegran upon the
chapit round about, all of brass. the second pillar also and the
pomegran were like unto these.

52:23 and there were nineti and six pomegran on a side; and all
th pomegran upon the network were an hundr round about.

52:24 and the captain of the guard took seraiah the chief priest, and
zephaniah the second priest, and the three keeper of the door: 52:25
he took also out of the citi an eunuch, which had the charg of the
men of war; and seven men of them that were near the king' person,
which were found in the city; and the princip scribe of the host,
who muster the peopl of the land; and threescor men of the people
of the land, that were found in the midst of the city.

52:26 So nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought
them to the king of babylon to riblah.

52:27 and the king of babylon smote them, and put them to death in
riblah in the land of hamath. thu judah wa carri away captiv out
of hi own land.

52:28 thi is the peopl whom nebuchadrezzar carri away captive: in
th seventh year three thousand jew and three and twenty: 52:29 in
th eighteenth year of nebuchadrezzar he carri away captiv from
jerusalem eight hundr thirti and two persons: 52:30 In the three and
twentieth year of nebuchadrezzar nebuzaradan the captain of the guard
carri away captiv of the jew seven hundr forti and five persons:
al the person were four thousand and six hundred.

52:31 and it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the
capt of jehoiachin king of judah, in the twelfth month, in the
fiv and twentieth day of the month, that evilmerodach king of babylon
in the first year of hi reign lift up the head of jehoiachin king
of judah, and brought him forth out of prison.

52:32 and spake kindli unto him, and set hi throne abov the throne
of the king that were with him in babylon, 52:33 and chang his
prison garments: and he did continu eat bread befor him all the
day of hi life.

52:34 and for hi diet, there wa a continu diet given him of the
k of babylon, everi day a portion until the day of hi death, all
th day of hi life.




th lament of jeremiah


1:1 how doth the citi sit solitary, that wa full of people! how is
sh becom as a widow! she that wa great among the nations, and
princess among the provinces, how is she becom tributary!  1:2 she
weepeth sore in the night, and her tear are on her cheeks: among all
her lover she hath none to comfort her: all her friend have dealt
treacher with her, they are becom her enemies.

1:3 judah is gone into captiv becaus of affliction, and becaus of
great servitude: she dwelleth among the heathen, she findeth no rest:
al her persecutor overtook her between the straits.

1:4 the way of zion do mourn, becaus none come to the solemn feasts:
al her gate are desolate: her priest sigh, her virgin are
afflicted, and she is in bitterness.

1:5 her adversari are the chief, her enemi prosper; for the lord
hath afflict her for the multitud of her transgressions: her
children are gone into captiv befor the enemy.

1:6 and from the daughter of zion all her beauti is departed: her
princ are becom like hart that find no pasture, and they are gone
without strength befor the pursuer.

1:7 jerusalem rememb in the day of her afflict and of her
miseri all her pleasant thing that she had in the day of old, when
her peopl fell into the hand of the enemy, and none did help her: the
adversari saw her, and did mock at her sabbaths.

1:8 jerusalem hath grievous sinned; therefor she is removed: all
that honour her despis her, becaus they have seen her nakedness:
yea, she sigheth, and turneth backward.

1:9 her filthi is in her skirts; she remembereth not her last end;
therefor she came down wonderfully: she had no comforter. O lord,
behold my affliction: for the enemi hath magnifi himself.

1:10 the adversari hath spread out hi hand upon all her pleasant
things: for she hath seen that the heathen enter into her sanctuary,
whom thou didst command that they should not enter into thy
congregation.

1:11 all her peopl sigh, they seek bread; they have given their
pleas thing for meat to reliev the soul: see, O lord, and
consider; for I am becom vile.

1:12 Is it noth to you, all ye that pass by? behold, and see if
ther be ani sorrow like unto my sorrow, which is done unto me,
wherewith the lord hath afflict me in the day of hi fierc anger.

1:13 from abov hath he sent fire into my bones, and it prevaileth
against them: he hath spread a net for my feet, he hath turn me
back: he hath made me desol and faint all the day.

1:14 the yoke of my transgress is bound by hi hand: they are
wreathed, and come up upon my neck: he hath made my strength to fall,
th lord hath deliv me into their hands, from whom I am not able
to rise up.

1:15 the lord hath trodden under foot all my mighti men in the midst
of me: he hath call an assembl against me to crush my young men:
th lord hath trodden the virgin, the daughter of judah, as in a
winepress.

1:16 for these thing I weep; mine eye, mine eye runneth down with
water, becaus the comfort that should reliev my soul is far from
me: my children are desolate, becaus the enemi prevailed.

1:17 zion spreadeth forth her hands, and there is none to comfort her:
th lord hath command concern jacob, that hi adversari should
b round about him: jerusalem is as a menstruou woman among them.

1:18 the lord is righteous; for I have rebel against his
commandment: hear, I pray you, all people, and behold my sorrow: my
virgin and my young men are gone into captivity.

1:19 I call for my lovers, but they deceiv me: my priest and mine
eld gave up the ghost in the city, while they sought their meat to
reliev their souls.

1:20 behold, O lord; for I am in distress: my bowel are troubled;
min heart is turn within me; for I have grievous rebelled: abroad
th sword bereaveth, at home there is as death.

1:21 they have heard that I sigh: there is none to comfort me: all
min enemi have heard of my trouble; they are glad that thou hast
don it: thou wilt bring the day that thou hast called, and they shall
b like unto me.

1:22 let all their wicked come befor thee; and do unto them, as
thou hast done unto me for all my transgressions: for my sigh are
many, and my heart is faint.

2:1 how hath the lord cover the daughter of zion with a cloud in his
anger, and cast down from heaven unto the earth the beauti of israel,
and rememb not hi footstool in the day of hi anger!  2:2 the
lord hath swallow up all the habit of jacob, and hath not
pitied: he hath thrown down in hi wrath the strong hold of the
daught of judah; he hath brought them down to the ground: he hath
pollut the kingdom and the princ thereof.

2:3 He hath cut off in hi fierc anger all the horn of israel: he
hath drawn back hi right hand from befor the enemy, and he burned
against jacob like a flame fire, which devoureth round about.

2:4 He hath bent hi bow like an enemy: he stood with hi right hand
a an adversary, and slew all that were pleasant to the eye in the
tabernacl of the daughter of zion: he pour out hi furi like fire.

2:5 the lord wa as an enemy: he hath swallow up israel, he hath
swallow up all her palaces: he hath destroy hi strong holds, and
hath increas in the daughter of judah mourn and lamentation.

2:6 and he hath violent taken away hi tabernacle, as if it were of
a garden: he hath destroy hi place of the assembly: the lord hath
caus the solemn feast and sabbath to be forgotten in zion, and
hath despis in the indign of hi anger the king and the priest.

2:7 the lord hath cast off hi altar, he hath abhor hi sanctuary,
h hath given up into the hand of the enemi the wall of her palaces;
they have made a nois in the hous of the lord, as in the day of a
solemn feast.

2:8 the lord hath purpos to destroy the wall of the daughter of
zion: he hath stretch out a line, he hath not withdrawn hi hand
from destroying: therefor he made the rampart and the wall to lament;
they languish together.

2:9 her gate are sunk into the ground; he hath destroy and broken
h bars: her king and her princ are among the gentiles: the law is
no more; her prophet also find no vision from the lord.

2:10 the elder of the daughter of zion sit upon the ground, and keep
silence: they have cast up dust upon their heads; they have girded
themselv with sackcloth: the virgin of jerusalem hang down their
head to the ground.

2:11 mine eye do fail with tears, my bowel are troubled, my liver is
pour upon the earth, for the destruct of the daughter of my
people; becaus the children and the suckl swoon in the street of
th city.

2:12 they say to their mothers, where is corn and wine? when they
swoon as the wound in the street of the city, when their soul was
pour out into their mothers' bosom.

2:13 what thing shall I take to wit for thee? what thing shall i
liken to thee, O daughter of jerusalem? what shall I equal to thee,
that I may comfort thee, O virgin daughter of zion? for thi breach is
great like the sea: who can heal thee?  2:14 thi prophet have seen
vain and foolish thing for thee: and they have not discov thine
iniquity, to turn away thi captivity; but have seen for thee false
burden and caus of banishment.

2:15 all that pass by clap their hand at thee; they hiss and wag
their head at the daughter of jerusalem, saying, Is thi the citi that
men call the perfect of beauty, the joy of the whole earth?  2:16
all thine enemi have open their mouth against thee: they hiss and
gnash the teeth: they say, We have swallow her up: certainli thi is
th day that we look for; we have found, we have seen it.

2:17 the lord hath done that which he had devised; he hath fulfilled
hi word that he had command in the day of old: he hath thrown
down, and hath not pitied: and he hath caus thine enemi to rejoice
ov thee, he hath set up the horn of thine adversaries.

2:18 their heart cri unto the lord, O wall of the daughter of zion,
let tear run down like a river day and night: give thyself no rest;
let not the appl of thine eye cease.

2:19 arise, cri out in the night: in the begin of the watch pour
out thine heart like water befor the face of the lord: lift up thy
hand toward him for the life of thi young children, that faint for
hung in the top of everi street.

2:20 behold, O lord, and consid to whom thou hast done this. shall
th women eat their fruit, and children of a span long? shall the
priest and the prophet be slain in the sanctuari of the lord?  2:21
the young and the old lie on the ground in the streets: my virgin and
mi young men are fallen by the sword; thou hast slain them in the day
of thine anger; thou hast killed, and not pitied.

2:22 thou hast call as in a solemn day my terror round about, so
that in the day of the lord' anger none escap nor remained: those
that I have swaddl and brought up hath mine enemi consumed.

3:1 I AM the man that hath seen afflict by the rod of hi wrath.

3:2 He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

3:3 sure against me is he turned; he turneth hi hand against me all
th day.

3:4 My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

3:5 He hath build against me, and compass me with gall and
travail.

3:6 He hath set me in dark places, as they that be dead of old.

3:7 He hath hedg me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my
chain heavy.

3:8 also when I cri and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

3:9 He hath inclos my way with hewn stone, he hath made my paths
crooked.

3:10 He wa unto me as a bear lie in wait, and as a lion in secret
places.

3:11 He hath turn asid my ways, and pull me in pieces: he hath
mad me desolate.

3:12 He hath bent hi bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

3:13 He hath caus the arrow of hi quiver to enter into my reins.

3:14 I wa a deris to all my people; and their song all the day.

3:15 He hath fill me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with
wormwood.

3:16 He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered
m with ashes.

3:17 and thou hast remov my soul far off from peace: I forgat
prosperity.

3:18 and I said, My strength and my hope is perish from the lord:
3:19 rememb mine afflict and my misery, the wormwood and the
gall.

3:20 My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbl in me.

3:21 thi I recal to my mind, therefor have I hope.

3:22 It is of the lord' merci that we are not consumed, becaus his
compass fail not.

3:23 they are new everi morning: great is thi faithfulness.

3:24 the lord is my portion, saith my soul; therefor will I hope in
him.

3:25 the lord is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that
seeketh him.

3:26 It is good that a man should both hope and quietli wait for the
salv of the lord.

3:27 It is good for a man that he bear the yoke of hi youth.

3:28 He sitteth alon and keepeth silence, becaus he hath born it
upon him.

3:29 He putteth hi mouth in the dust; if so be there may be hope.

3:30 He giveth hi cheek to him that smiteth him: he is fill full
with reproach.

3:31 for the lord will not cast off for ever: 3:32 but though he cause
grief, yet will he have compass accord to the multitud of his
mercies.

3:33 for he doth not afflict willingli nor griev the children of men.

3:34 To crush under hi feet all the prison of the earth.

3:35 To turn asid the right of a man befor the face of the most
high, 3:36 To subvert a man in hi cause, the lord approveth not.

3:37 who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the lord
commandeth it not?  3:38 out of the mouth of the most high proceedeth
not evil and good?  3:39 wherefor doth a live man complain, a man
for the punish of hi sins?  3:40 let us search and tri our ways,
and turn again to the lord.

3:41 let us lift up our heart with our hand unto god in the heavens.

3:42 We have transgress and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

3:43 thou hast cover with anger, and persecut us: thou hast slain,
thou hast not pitied.

3:44 thou hast cover thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should
not pass through.

3:45 thou hast made us as the offscour and refus in the midst of
th people.

3:46 all our enemi have open their mouth against us.

3:47 fear and a snare is come upon us, desol and destruction.

3:48 mine eye runneth down with river of water for the destruct of
th daughter of my people.

3:49 mine eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any
intermission.

3:50 till the lord look down, and behold from heaven.

3:51 mine eye affecteth mine heart becaus of all the daughter of my
city.

3:52 mine enemi chase me sore, like a bird, without cause.

3:53 they have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon
me.

3:54 water flow over mine head; then I said, I am cut off.

3:55 I call upon thi name, O lord, out of the low dungeon.

3:56 thou hast heard my voice: hide not thine ear at my breathing, at
mi cry.

3:57 thou drewest near in the day that I call upon thee: thou
saidst, fear not.

3:58 O lord, thou hast plead the caus of my soul; thou hast
redeem my life.

3:59 O lord, thou hast seen my wrong: judg thou my cause.

3:60 thou hast seen all their vengeanc and all their imaginations
against me.

3:61 thou hast heard their reproach, O lord, and all their
imagin against me; 3:62 the lip of those that rose up against
me, and their devic against me all the day.

3:63 behold their sit down, and their rise up; I am their
musick.

3:64 render unto them a recompence, O lord, accord to the work of
their hands.

3:65 give them sorrow of heart, thi curs unto them.

3:66 persecut and destroy them in anger from under the heaven of the
lord.

4:1 how is the gold becom dim! how is the most fine gold changed! the
ston of the sanctuari are pour out in the top of everi street.

4:2 the preciou son of zion, compar to fine gold, how are they
esteem as earthen pitchers, the work of the hand of the potter!
4:3 even the sea monster draw out the breast, they give suck to their
young ones: the daughter of my peopl is becom cruel, like the
ostrich in the wilderness.

4:4 the tongu of the suck child cleaveth to the roof of hi mouth
for thirst: the young children ask bread, and no man breaketh it unto
them.

4:5 they that did feed delic are desol in the streets: they
that were brought up in scarlet embrac dunghills.

4:6 for the punish of the iniqu of the daughter of my peopl is
great than the punish of the sin of sodom, that wa overthrown
a in a moment, and no hand stay on her.

4:7 her nazarit were purer than snow, they were whiter than milk,
they were more ruddi in bodi than rubies, their polish wa of
sapphire: 4:8 their visag is blacker than a coal; they are not known
in the streets: their skin cleaveth to their bones; it is withered, it
i becom like a stick.

4:9 they that be slain with the sword are better than they that be
slain with hunger: for these pine away, stricken through for want of
th fruit of the field.

4:10 the hand of the piti women have sodden their own children:
they were their meat in the destruct of the daughter of my people.

4:11 the lord hath accomplish hi fury; he hath pour out his
fierc anger, and hath kindl a fire in zion, and it hath devoured
th foundat thereof.

4:12 the king of the earth, and all the inhabit of the world,
would not have believ that the adversari and the enemi should have
ent into the gate of jerusalem.

4:13 for the sin of her prophets, and the iniqu of her priests,
that have shed the blood of the just in the midst of her, 4:14 they
hav wander as blind men in the streets, they have polluted
themselv with blood, so that men could not touch their garments.

4:15 they cri unto them, depart ye; it is unclean; depart, depart,
touch not: when they fled away and wandered, they said among the
heathen, they shall no more sojourn there.
