4:16 the anger of the lord hath divid them; he will no more regard
them: they respect not the person of the priests, they favour not
th elders.

4:17 As for us, our eye as yet fail for our vain help: in our
watch we have watch for a nation that could not save us.

4:18 they hunt our steps, that we cannot go in our streets: our end is
near, our day are fulfilled; for our end is come.

4:19 our persecutor are swifter than the eagl of the heaven: they
pursu us upon the mountains, they laid wait for us in the
wilderness.

4:20 the breath of our nostrils, the anoint of the lord, wa taken
in their pits, of whom we said, under hi shadow we shall live among
th heathen.

4:21 rejoic and be glad, O daughter of edom, that dwellest in the
land of uz; the cup also shall pass through unto thee: thou shalt be
drunken, and shalt make thyself naked.

4:22 the punish of thine iniqu is accomplished, O daughter of
zion; he will no more carri thee away into captivity: he will visit
thin iniquity, O daughter of edom; he will discov thi sins.

5:1 remember, O lord, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our
reproach.

5:2 our inherit is turn to strangers, our hous to aliens.

5:3 We are orphan and fatherless, our mother are as widows.

5:4 We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.

5:5 our neck are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.

5:6 We have given the hand to the egyptians, and to the assyrians, to
b satisfi with bread.

5:7 our father have sinned, and are not; and we have born their
iniquities.

5:8 servant have rule over us: there is none that doth deliv us
out of their hand.

5:9 We gat our bread with the peril of our live becaus of the sword
of the wilderness.

5:10 our skin wa black like an oven becaus of the terribl famine.

5:11 they ravish the women in zion, and the maid in the citi of
judah.

5:12 princ are hang up by their hand: the face of elder were not
honoured.

5:13 they took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the
wood.

5:14 the elder have ceas from the gate, the young men from their
musick.

5:15 the joy of our heart is ceased; our danc is turn into
mourning.

5:16 the crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have
sinned!  5:17 for thi our heart is faint; for these thing our eyes
ar dim.

5:18 becaus of the mountain of zion, which is desolate, the foxes
walk upon it.

5:19 thou, O lord, remainest for ever; thi throne from gener to
generation.

5:20 wherefor dost thou forget us for ever, and forsak us so long
time?  5:21 turn thou us unto thee, O lord, and we shall be turned;
renew our day as of old.

5:22 but thou hast utterli reject us; thou art veri wroth against us.




th book of the prophet ezekiel


1:1 now it came to pass in the thirtieth year, in the fourth month,
in the fifth day of the month, as I wa among the captiv by the river
of chebar, that the heaven were opened, and I saw vision of god.

1:2 In the fifth day of the month, which wa the fifth year of king
jehoiachin' captivity, 1:3 the word of the lord came expressli unto
ezekiel the priest, the son of buzi, in the land of the chaldean by
th river chebar; and the hand of the lord wa there upon him.

1:4 and I looked, and, behold, a whirlwind came out of the north, a
great cloud, and a fire infold itself, and a bright wa about
it, and out of the midst thereof as the colour of amber, out of the
midst of the fire.

1:5 also out of the midst thereof came the like of four living
creatures. and thi wa their appearance; they had the like of a
man.

1:6 and everi one had four faces, and everi one had four wings.

1:7 and their feet were straight feet; and the sole of their feet was
lik the sole of a calf' foot: and they sparkl like the colour of
burnish brass.

1:8 and they had the hand of a man under their wing on their four
sides; and they four had their face and their wings.

1:9 their wing were join one to another; they turn not when they
went; they went everi one straight forward.

1:10 As for the like of their faces, they four had the face of a
man, and the face of a lion, on the right side: and they four had the
fac of an ox on the left side; they four also had the face of an
eagle.

1:11 thu were their faces: and their wing were stretch upward; two
w of everi one were join one to another, and two cover their
bodies.

1:12 and they went everi one straight forward: whither the spirit was
to go, they went; and they turn not when they went.

1:13 As for the like of the live creatures, their appear was
lik burn coal of fire, and like the appear of lamps: it went
up and down among the live creatures; and the fire wa bright, and
out of the fire went forth lightning.

1:14 and the live creatur ran and return as the appear of a
flash of lightning.

1:15 now as I beheld the live creatures, behold one wheel upon the
earth by the live creatures, with hi four faces.

1:16 the appear of the wheel and their work wa like unto the
colour of a beryl: and they four had one likeness: and their
appear and their work wa as it were a wheel in the middl of a
wheel.

1:17 when they went, they went upon their four sides: and they turned
not when they went.

1:18 As for their rings, they were so high that they were dreadful;
and their ring were full of eye round about them four.

1:19 and when the live creatur went, the wheel went by them: and
when the live creatur were lift up from the earth, the wheels
wer lift up.

1:20 whithersoev the spirit wa to go, they went, thither wa their
spirit to go; and the wheel were lift up over against them: for the
spirit of the live creatur wa in the wheels.

1:21 when those went, these went; and when those stood, these stood;
and when those were lift up from the earth, the wheel were lifted
up over against them: for the spirit of the live creatur wa in the
wheels.

1:22 and the like of the firmament upon the head of the living
creatur wa as the colour of the terribl crystal, stretch forth
ov their head above.

1:23 and under the firmament were their wing straight, the one toward
th other: everi one had two, which cover on thi side, and every
on had two, which cover on that side, their bodies.

1:24 and when they went, I heard the nois of their wings, like the
nois of great waters, as the voic of the almighty, the voic of
speech, as the nois of an host: when they stood, they let down their
wings.

1:25 and there wa a voic from the firmament that wa over their
heads, when they stood, and had let down their wings.

1:26 and abov the firmament that wa over their head wa the
lik of a throne, as the appear of a sapphir stone: and upon
th like of the throne wa the like as the appear of a man
abov upon it.

1:27 and I saw as the colour of amber, as the appear of fire round
about within it, from the appear of hi loin even upward, and
from the appear of hi loin even downward, I saw as it were the
appear of fire, and it had bright round about.

1:28 As the appear of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of
rain, so wa the appear of the bright round about. thi was
th appear of the like of the glori of the lord. and when i
saw it, I fell upon my face, and I heard a voic of one that spake.

2:1 and he said unto me, son of man, stand upon thi feet, and I will
speak unto thee.

2:2 and the spirit enter into me when he spake unto me, and set me
upon my feet, that I heard him that spake unto me.

2:3 and he said unto me, son of man, I send thee to the children of
israel, to a rebelli nation that hath rebel against me: they and
their father have transgress against me, even unto thi veri day.

2:4 for they are impud children and stiffhearted. I do send thee
unto them; and thou shalt say unto them, thu saith the lord god.

2:5 and they, whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear,
(for they are a rebelli house,) yet shall know that there hath been
a prophet among them.

2:6 and thou, son of man, be not afraid of them, neither be afraid of
their words, though brier and thorn be with thee, and thou dost
dwel among scorpions: be not afraid of their words, nor be dismayed
at their looks, though they be a rebelli house.

2:7 and thou shalt speak my word unto them, whether they will hear,
or whether they will forbear: for they are most rebellious.

2:8 but thou, son of man, hear what I say unto thee; Be not thou
rebelli like that rebelli house: open thi mouth, and eat that i
giv thee.

2:9 and when I looked, behold, an hand wa sent unto me; and, lo, a
rol of a book wa therein; 2:10 and he spread it befor me; and it
wa written within and without: and there wa written therein
lamentations, and mourning, and woe.

3:1 moreov he said unto me, son of man, eat that thou findest; eat
thi roll, and go speak unto the hous of israel.

3:2 So I open my mouth, and he caus me to eat that roll.

3:3 and he said unto me, son of man, caus thi belli to eat, and fill
thi bowel with thi roll that I give thee. then did I eat it; and it
wa in my mouth as honey for sweetness.

3:4 and he said unto me, son of man, go, get thee unto the hous of
israel, and speak with my word unto them.

3:5 for thou art not sent to a peopl of a strang speech and of an
hard language, but to the hous of israel; 3:6 not to mani peopl of a
strang speech and of an hard language, whose word thou canst not
understand. surely, had I sent thee to them, they would have hearkened
unto thee.

3:7 but the hous of israel will not hearken unto thee; for they will
not hearken unto me: for all the hous of israel are impud and
hardhearted.

3:8 behold, I have made thi face strong against their faces, and thy
forehead strong against their foreheads.

3:9 As an adam harder than flint have I made thi forehead: fear
them not, neither be dismay at their looks, though they be a
rebelli house.

3:10 moreov he said unto me, son of man, all my word that I shall
speak unto thee receiv in thine heart, and hear with thine ears.

3:11 and go, get thee to them of the captivity, unto the children of
thi people, and speak unto them, and tell them, thu saith the lord
god; whether they will hear, or whether they will forbear.

3:12 then the spirit took me up, and I heard behind me a voic of a
great rushing, saying, bless be the glori of the lord from his
place.

3:13 I heard also the nois of the wing of the live creatur that
touch one another, and the nois of the wheel over against them,
and a nois of a great rushing.

3:14 So the spirit lift me up, and took me away, and I went in
bitterness, in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the lord was
strong upon me.

3:15 then I came to them of the captiv at telabib, that dwelt by
th river of chebar, and I sat where they sat, and remain there
astonish among them seven days.

3:16 and it came to pass at the end of seven days, that the word of
th lord came unto me, saying, 3:17 son of man, I have made thee a
watchman unto the hous of israel: therefor hear the word at my
mouth, and give them warn from me.

3:18 when I say unto the wicked, thou shalt sure die; and thou
givest him not warning, nor speakest to warn the wick from his
wick way, to save hi life; the same wick man shall die in his
iniquity; but hi blood will I requir at thine hand.

3:19 yet if thou warn the wicked, and he turn not from hi wickedness,
nor from hi wick way, he shall die in hi iniquity; but thou hast
deliv thi soul.

3:20 again, when a righteou man doth turn from hi righteousness, and
commit iniquity, and I lay a stumbling-block befor him, he shall die:
becaus thou hast not given him warning, he shall die in hi sin, and
hi righteous which he hath done shall not be remembered; but his
blood will I requir at thine hand.

3:21 nevertheless if thou warn the righteou man, that the righteous
sin not, and he doth not sin, he shall sure live, becaus he is
warned; also thou hast deliv thi soul.

3:22 and the hand of the lord wa there upon me; and he said unto me,
arise, go forth into the plain, and I will there talk with thee.

3:23 then I arose, and went forth into the plain: and, behold, the
glori of the lord stood there, as the glori which I saw by the river
of chebar: and I fell on my face.

3:24 then the spirit enter into me, and set me upon my feet, and
spak with me, and said unto me, go, shut thyself within thine house.

3:25 but thou, O son of man, behold, they shall put band upon thee,
and shall bind thee with them, and thou shalt not go out among them:
3:26 and I will make thi tongu cleav to the roof of thi mouth, that
thou shalt be dumb, and shalt not be to them a reprover: for they are
a rebelli house.

3:27 but when I speak with thee, I will open thi mouth, and thou shalt
say unto them, thu saith the lord god; He that heareth, let him hear;
and he that forbeareth, let him forbear: for they are a rebellious
house.

4:1 thou also, son of man, take thee a tile, and lay it befor thee,
and pourtray upon it the city, even jerusalem: 4:2 and lay siege
against it, and build a fort against it, and cast a mount against it;
set the camp also against it, and set batter ram against it round
about.

4:3 moreov take thou unto thee an iron pan, and set it for a wall of
iron between thee and the city: and set thi face against it, and it
shal be besieged, and thou shalt lay sieg against it. thi shall be
a sign to the hous of israel.

4:4 lie thou also upon thi left side, and lay the iniqu of the
hous of israel upon it: accord to the number of the day that thou
shalt lie upon it thou shalt bear their iniquity.

4:5 for I have laid upon thee the year of their iniquity, according
to the number of the days, three hundr and nineti days: so shalt
thou bear the iniqu of the hous of israel.

4:6 and when thou hast accomplish them, lie again on thi right side,
and thou shalt bear the iniqu of the hous of judah forti days: i
hav appoint thee each day for a year.

4:7 therefor thou shalt set thi face toward the sieg of jerusalem,
and thine arm shall be uncovered, and thou shalt prophesi against it.

4:8 and, behold, I will lay band upon thee, and thou shalt not turn
the from one side to another, till thou hast end the day of thy
siege.

4:9 take thou also unto thee wheat, and barley, and beans, and
lentiles, and millet, and fitches, and put them in one vessel, and
mak thee bread thereof, accord to the number of the day that thou
shalt lie upon thi side, three hundr and nineti day shalt thou eat
thereof.

4:10 and thi meat which thou shalt eat shall be by weight, twenty
shekel a day: from time to time shalt thou eat it.

4:11 thou shalt drink also water by measure, the sixth part of an hin:
from time to time shalt thou drink.

4:12 and thou shalt eat it as barley cakes, and thou shalt bake it
with dung that cometh out of man, in their sight.

4:13 and the lord said, even thu shall the children of israel eat
their defil bread among the gentiles, whither I will drive them.

4:14 then said I, Ah lord god! behold, my soul hath not been polluted:
for from my youth up even till now have I not eaten of that which
dieth of itself, or is torn in pieces; neither came there abominable
flesh into my mouth.

4:15 then he said unto me, lo, I have given thee cow' dung for man's
dung, and thou shalt prepar thi bread therewith.

4:16 moreov he said unto me, son of man, behold, I will break the
staff of bread in jerusalem: and they shall eat bread by weight, and
with care; and they shall drink water by measure, and with
astonishment: 4:17 that they may want bread and water, and be astonied
on with another, and consum away for their iniquity.

5:1 and thou, son of man, take thee a sharp knife, take thee a
barber' razor, and caus it to pass upon thine head and upon thy
beard: then take thee balanc to weigh, and divid the hair.

5:2 thou shalt burn with fire a third part in the midst of the city,
when the day of the sieg are fulfilled: and thou shalt take a third
part, and smite about it with a knife: and a third part thou shalt
scatt in the wind; and I will draw out a sword after them.

5:3 thou shalt also take thereof a few in number, and bind them in thy
skirts.

5:4 then take of them again, and cast them into the midst of the fire,
and burn them in the fire; for thereof shall a fire come forth into
al the hous of israel.

5:5 thu saith the lord god; thi is jerusalem: I have set it in the
midst of the nation and countri that are round about her.

5:6 and she hath chang my judgment into wicked more than the
nations, and my statut more than the countri that are round about
her: for they have refus my judgment and my statutes, they have not
walk in them.

5:7 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus ye multipli more than
th nation that are round about you, and have not walk in my
statutes, neither have kept my judgments, neither have done according
to the judgment of the nation that are round about you; 5:8
therefor thu saith the lord god; behold, I, even I, am against thee,
and will execut judgment in the midst of thee in the sight of the
nations.

5:9 and I will do in thee that which I have not done, and whereunto i
wil not do ani more the like, becaus of all thine abominations.

5:10 therefor the father shall eat the son in the midst of thee,
and the son shall eat their fathers; and I will execut judgment in
thee, and the whole remnant of thee will I scatter into all the winds.

5:11 wherefore, as I live, saith the lord god; surely, becaus thou
hast defil my sanctuari with all thi detest things, and with all
thin abominations, therefor will I also diminish thee; neither shall
min eye spare, neither will I have ani pity.

5:12 A third part of thee shall die with the pestilence, and with
famin shall they be consum in the midst of thee: and a third part
shal fall by the sword round about thee; and I will scatter a third
part into all the winds, and I will draw out a sword after them.

5:13 thu shall mine anger be accomplished, and I will caus my fury
to rest upon them, and I will be comforted: and they shall know that i
th lord have spoken it in my zeal, when I have accomplish my fury
in them.

5:14 moreov I will make thee waste, and a reproach among the nations
that are round about thee, in the sight of all that pass by.

5:15 So it shall be a reproach and a taunt, an instruct and an
astonish unto the nation that are round about thee, when I shall
execut judgment in thee in anger and in furi and in furiou rebukes.
i the lord have spoken it.

5:16 when I shall send upon them the evil arrow of famine, which
shal be for their destruction, and which I will send to destroy you:
and I will increas the famin upon you, and will break your staff of
bread: 5:17 So will I send upon you famin and evil beasts, and they
shal bereav thee: and pestil and blood shall pass through thee;
and I will bring the sword upon thee. I the lord have spoken it.

6:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 6:2 son of man, set
thi face toward the mountain of israel, and prophesi against them,
6:3 and say, Ye mountain of israel, hear the word of the lord god;
thu saith the lord god to the mountains, and to the hills, to the
rivers, and to the valleys; behold, I, even I, will bring a sword upon
you, and I will destroy your high places.

6:4 and your altar shall be desolate, and your imag shall be
broken: and I will cast down your slain men befor your idols.

6:5 and I will lay the dead carcas of the children of israel before
their idols; and I will scatter your bone round about your altars.

6:6 In all your dwellingplac the citi shall be laid waste, and the
high place shall be desolate; that your altar may be laid wast and
mad desolate, and your idol may be broken and cease, and your images
may be cut down, and your work may be abolished.

6:7 and the slain shall fall in the midst of you, and ye shall know
that I am the lord.

6:8 yet will I leav a remnant, that ye may have some that shall
escap the sword among the nations, when ye shall be scatter through
th countries.

6:9 and they that escap of you shall rememb me among the nations
whith they shall be carri captives, becaus I am broken with their
whorish heart, which hath depart from me, and with their eyes, which
go a whore after their idols: and they shall loth themselv for
th evil which they have commit in all their abominations.

6:10 and they shall know that I am the lord, and that I have not said
in vain that I would do thi evil unto them.

6:11 thu saith the lord god; smite with thine hand, and stamp with
thi foot, and say, ala for all the evil abomin of the hous of
israel! for they shall fall by the sword, by the famine, and by the
pestilence.

6:12 He that is far off shall die of the pestilence; and he that is
near shall fall by the sword; and he that remaineth and is besieged
shal die by the famine: thu will I accomplish my furi upon them.

6:13 then shall ye know that I am the lord, when their slain men shall
b among their idol round about their altars, upon everi high hill,
in all the top of the mountains, and under everi green tree, and
und everi thick oak, the place where they did offer sweet savour to
al their idols.

6:14 So will I stretch out my hand upon them, and make the land
desolate, yea, more desol than the wilder toward diblath, in
al their habitations: and they shall know that I am the lord.

7:1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 7:2 also, thou
son of man, thu saith the lord god unto the land of israel; An end,
th end is come upon the four corner of the land.

7:3 now is the end come upon thee, and I will send mine anger upon
thee, and will judg thee accord to thi ways, and will recompense
upon thee all thine abominations.

7:4 and mine eye shall not spare thee, neither will I have pity: but i
wil recompens thi way upon thee, and thine abomin shall be in
th midst of thee: and ye shall know that I am the lord.

7:5 thu saith the lord god; An evil, an onli evil, behold, is come.

7:6 An end is come, the end is come: it watcheth for thee; behold, it
i come.

7:7 the morn is come unto thee, O thou that dwellest in the land:
th time is come, the day of troubl is near, and not the sounding
again of the mountains.

7:8 now will I shortli pour out my furi upon thee, and accomplish mine
ang upon thee: and I will judg thee accord to thi ways, and will
recompens thee for all thine abominations.

7:9 and mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity: I will
recompens thee accord to thi way and thine abomin that are
in the midst of thee; and ye shall know that I am the lord that
smiteth.

7:10 behold the day, behold, it is come: the morn is gone forth;
th rod hath blossomed, pride hath budded.

7:11 violenc is risen up into a rod of wickedness: none of them shall
remain, nor of their multitude, nor of ani of their's: neither shall
ther be wail for them.

7:12 the time is come, the day draweth near: let not the buyer
rejoice, nor the seller mourn: for wrath is upon all the multitude
thereof.

7:13 for the seller shall not return to that which is sold, although
they were yet alive: for the vision is touch the whole multitude
thereof, which shall not return; neither shall ani strengthen himself
in the iniqu of hi life.

7:14 they have blown the trumpet, even to make all ready; but none
goeth to the battle: for my wrath is upon all the multitud thereof.

7:15 the sword is without, and the pestil and the famin within:
h that is in the field shall die with the sword; and he that is in
th city, famin and pestil shall devour him.

7:16 but they that escap of them shall escape, and shall be on the
mountain like dove of the valleys, all of them mourning, everi one
for hi iniquity.

7:17 all hand shall be feeble, and all knee shall be weak as water.

7:18 they shall also gird themselv with sackcloth, and horror shall
cov them; and shame shall be upon all faces, and bald upon all
their heads.

7:19 they shall cast their silver in the streets, and their gold shall
b removed: their silver and their gold shall not be abl to deliver
them in the day of the wrath of the lord: they shall not satisfi their
souls, neither fill their bowels: becaus it is the stumblingblock of
their iniquity.

7:20 As for the beauti of hi ornament, he set it in majesty: but they
mad the imag of their abomin and of their detest things
therein: therefor have I set it far from them.

7:21 and I will give it into the hand of the stranger for a prey,
and to the wick of the earth for a spoil; and they shall pollut it.

7:22 My face will I turn also from them, and they shall pollut my
secret place: for the robber shall enter into it, and defil it.

7:23 make a chain: for the land is full of bloodi crimes, and the city
i full of violence.

7:24 wherefor I will bring the worst of the heathen, and they shall
possess their houses: I will also make the pomp of the strong to
cease; and their holi place shall be defiled.

7:25 destruct cometh; and they shall seek peace, and there shall be
none.

7:26 mischief shall come upon mischief, and rumour shall be upon
rumour; then shall they seek a vision of the prophet; but the law
shal perish from the priest, and counsel from the ancients.

7:27 the king shall mourn, and the princ shall be cloth with
desolation, and the hand of the peopl of the land shall be troubled:
i will do unto them after their way, and accord to their deserts
wil I judg them; and they shall know that I am the lord.

8:1 and it came to pass in the sixth year, in the sixth month, in the
fifth day of the month, as I sat in mine house, and the elder of
judah sat befor me, that the hand of the lord god fell there upon me.

8:2 then I beheld, and lo a like as the appear of fire: from
th appear of hi loin even downward, fire; and from hi loins
even upward, as the appear of brightness, as the colour of amber.

8:3 and he put forth the form of an hand, and took me by a lock of
min head; and the spirit lift me up between the earth and the
heaven, and brought me in the vision of god to jerusalem, to the door
of the inner gate that looketh toward the north; where wa the seat of
th imag of jealousy, which provoketh to jealousy.

8:4 and, behold, the glori of the god of israel wa there, according
to the vision that I saw in the plain.

8:5 then said he unto me, son of man, lift up thine eye now the way
toward the north. So I lift up mine eye the way toward the north,
and behold northward at the gate of the altar thi imag of jealousy
in the entry.

8:6 He said furthermor unto me, son of man, seest thou what they do?
even the great abomin that the hous of israel committeth here,
that I should go far off from my sanctuary? but turn thee yet again,
and thou shalt see greater abominations.

8:7 and he brought me to the door of the court; and when I looked,
behold a hole in the wall.

8:8 then said he unto me, son of man, dig now in the wall: and when i
had dig in the wall, behold a door.

8:9 and he said unto me, Go in, and behold the wick abominations
that they do here.

8:10 So I went in and saw; and behold everi form of creep things,
and abomin beasts, and all the idol of the hous of israel,
pourtray upon the wall round about.

8:11 and there stood befor them seventi men of the ancient of the
hous of israel, and in the midst of them stood jaazaniah the son of
shaphan, with everi man hi censer in hi hand; and a thick cloud of
incens went up.

8:12 then said he unto me, son of man, hast thou seen what the
anci of the hous of israel do in the dark, everi man in the
chamb of hi imagery? for they say, the lord seeth us not; the lord
hath forsaken the earth.

8:13 He said also unto me, turn thee yet again, and thou shalt see
great abomin that they do.

8:14 then he brought me to the door of the gate of the lord' house
which wa toward the north; and, behold, there sat women weep for
tammuz.

8:15 then said he unto me, hast thou seen this, O son of man? turn
the yet again, and thou shalt see greater abomin than these.

8:16 and he brought me into the inner court of the lord' house, and,
behold, at the door of the templ of the lord, between the porch and
th altar, were about five and twenti men, with their back toward the
templ of the lord, and their face toward the east; and they
worship the sun toward the east.

8:17 then he said unto me, hast thou seen this, O son of man? Is it a
light thing to the hous of judah that they commit the abominations
which they commit here? for they have fill the land with violence,
and have return to provok me to anger: and, lo, they put the branch
to their nose.

8:18 therefor will I also deal in fury: mine eye shall not spare,
neith will I have pity: and though they cri in mine ear with a loud
voice, yet will I not hear them.

9:1 He cri also in mine ear with a loud voice, saying, caus them
that have charg over the citi to draw near, even everi man with his
destroy weapon in hi hand.

9:2 and, behold, six men came from the way of the higher gate, which
lieth toward the north, and everi man a slaughter weapon in hi hand;
and one man among them wa cloth with linen, with a writer' inkhorn
bi hi side: and they went in, and stood besid the brasen altar.

9:3 and the glori of the god of israel wa gone up from the cherub,
whereupon he was, to the threshold of the house. and he call to the
man cloth with linen, which had the writer' inkhorn by hi side;
9:4 and the lord said unto him, Go through the midst of the city,
through the midst of jerusalem, and set a mark upon the forehead of
th men that sigh and that cri for all the abomin that be done
in the midst thereof.

9:5 and to the other he said in mine hearing, Go ye after him through
th city, and smite: let not your eye spare, neither have ye pity: 9:6
slay utterli old and young, both maids, and littl children, and
women: but come not near ani man upon whom is the mark; and begin at
mi sanctuary. then they began at the ancient men which were befor the
house.

9:7 and he said unto them, defil the house, and fill the court with
th slain: go ye forth. and they went forth, and slew in the city.

9:8 and it came to pass, while they were slay them, and I wa left,
that I fell upon my face, and cried, and said, Ah lord god! wilt thou
destroy all the residu of israel in thi pour out of thi furi upon
jerusalem?  9:9 then said he unto me, the iniqu of the hous of
israel and judah is exceed great, and the land is full of blood,
and the citi full of perverseness: for they say, the lord hath
forsaken the earth, and the lord seeth not.

9:10 and as for me also, mine eye shall not spare, neither will I have
pity, but I will recompens their way upon their head.

9:11 and, behold, the man cloth with linen, which had the inkhorn by
hi side, report the matter, saying, I have done as thou hast
command me.

10:1 then I looked, and, behold, in the firmament that wa abov the
head of the cherubim there appear over them as it were a sapphire
stone, as the appear of the like of a throne.

10:2 and he spake unto the man cloth with linen, and said, Go in
between the wheels, even under the cherub, and fill thine hand with
coal of fire from between the cherubims, and scatter them over the
city. and he went in in my sight.

10:3 now the cherubim stood on the right side of the house, when the
man went in; and the cloud fill the inner court.

10:4 then the glori of the lord went up from the cherub, and stood
ov the threshold of the house; and the hous wa fill with the
cloud, and the court wa full of the bright of the lord' glory.

10:5 and the sound of the cherubims' wing wa heard even to the outer
court, as the voic of the almighti god when he speaketh.

10:6 and it came to pass, that when he had command the man clothed
with linen, saying, take fire from between the wheels, from between
th cherubims; then he went in, and stood besid the wheels.

10:7 and one cherub stretch forth hi hand from between the
cherubim unto the fire that wa between the cherubims, and took
thereof, and put it into the hand of him that wa cloth with linen:
who took it, and went out.

10:8 and there appear in the cherubim the form of a man' hand
und their wings.

10:9 and when I looked, behold the four wheel by the cherubims, one
wheel by one cherub, and anoth wheel by anoth cherub: and the
appear of the wheel wa as the colour of a beryl stone.

10:10 and as for their appearances, they four had one likeness, as if
a wheel had been in the midst of a wheel.

10:11 when they went, they went upon their four sides; they turn not
a they went, but to the place whither the head look they followed
it; they turn not as they went.

10:12 and their whole body, and their backs, and their hands, and
their wings, and the wheels, were full of eye round about, even the
wheel that they four had.

10:13 As for the wheels, it wa cri unto them in my hearing, o
wheel.

10:14 and everi one had four faces: the first face wa the face of a
cherub, and the second face wa the face of a man, and the third the
fac of a lion, and the fourth the face of an eagle.

10:15 and the cherubim were lift up. thi is the live creature
that I saw by the river of chebar.

10:16 and when the cherubim went, the wheel went by them: and when
th cherubim lift up their wing to mount up from the earth, the
sam wheel also turn not from besid them.

10:17 when they stood, these stood; and when they were lift up,
thes lift up themselv also: for the spirit of the live creature
wa in them.

10:18 then the glori of the lord depart from off the threshold of
th house, and stood over the cherubims.

10:19 and the cherubim lift up their wings, and mount up from the
earth in my sight: when they went out, the wheel also were beside
them, and everi one stood at the door of the east gate of the lord's
house; and the glori of the god of israel wa over them above.

10:20 thi is the live creatur that I saw under the god of israel
bi the river of chebar; and I knew that they were the cherubims.

10:21 everi one had four face apiece, and everi one four wings; and
th like of the hand of a man wa under their wings.

10:22 and the like of their face wa the same face which I saw
bi the river of chebar, their appear and themselves: they went
everi one straight forward.

11:1 moreov the spirit lift me up, and brought me unto the east
gat of the lord' house, which looketh eastward: and behold at the
door of the gate five and twenti men; among whom I saw jaazaniah the
son of azur, and pelatiah the son of benaiah, princ of the people.

11:2 then said he unto me, son of man, these are the men that devise
mischief, and give wick counsel in thi city: 11:3 which say, It is
not near; let us build houses: thi citi is the caldron, and we be the
flesh.

11:4 therefor prophesi against them, prophesy, O son of man.

11:5 and the spirit of the lord fell upon me, and said unto me, speak;
thu saith the lord; thu have ye said, O hous of israel: for I know
th thing that come into your mind, everi one of them.

11:6 Ye have multipli your slain in thi city, and ye have filled
th street thereof with the slain.

11:7 therefor thu saith the lord god; your slain whom ye have laid
in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and thi citi is the caldron:
but I will bring you forth out of the midst of it.

11:8 Ye have fear the sword; and I will bring a sword upon you,
saith the lord god.

11:9 and I will bring you out of the midst thereof, and deliv you
into the hand of strangers, and will execut judgment among you.

11:10 Ye shall fall by the sword; I will judg you in the border of
israel; and ye shall know that I am the lord.

11:11 thi citi shall not be your caldron, neither shall ye be the
flesh in the midst thereof; but I will judg you in the border of
israel: 11:12 and ye shall know that I am the lord: for ye have not
walk in my statutes, neither execut my judgments, but have done
aft the manner of the heathen that are round about you.

11:13 and it came to pass, when I prophesied, that pelatiah the son of
benaiah died. then fell I down upon my face, and cri with a loud
voice, and said, Ah lord god! wilt thou make a full end of the remnant
of israel?  11:14 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying,
11:15 son of man, thi brethren, even thi brethren, the men of thy
kindred, and all the hous of israel wholly, are they unto whom the
inhabit of jerusalem have said, get you far from the lord: unto us
i thi land given in possession.

11:16 therefor say, thu saith the lord god; although I have cast
them far off among the heathen, and although I have scatter them
among the countries, yet will I be to them as a littl sanctuari in
th countri where they shall come.

11:17 therefor say, thu saith the lord god; I will even gather you
from the people, and assembl you out of the countri where ye have
been scattered, and I will give you the land of israel.

11:18 and they shall come thither, and they shall take away all the
detest thing thereof and all the abomin thereof from
thence.

11:19 and I will give them one heart, and I will put a new spirit
within you; and I will take the stoni heart out of their flesh, and
wil give them an heart of flesh: 11:20 that they may walk in my
statutes, and keep mine ordinances, and do them: and they shall be my
people, and I will be their god.

11:21 but as for them whose heart walketh after the heart of their
detest thing and their abominations, I will recompens their way
upon their own heads, saith the lord god.

11:22 then did the cherubim lift up their wings, and the wheels
besid them; and the glori of the god of israel wa over them above.

11:23 and the glori of the lord went up from the midst of the city,
and stood upon the mountain which is on the east side of the city.

11:24 afterward the spirit took me up, and brought me in a vision by
th spirit of god into chaldea, to them of the captivity. So the
vis that I had seen went up from me.

11:25 then I spake unto them of the captiv all the thing that the
lord had shew me.

12:1 the word of the lord also came unto me, saying, 12:2 son of man,
thou dwellest in the midst of a rebelli house, which have eye to
see, and see not; they have ear to hear, and hear not: for they are a
rebelli house.

12:3 therefore, thou son of man, prepar thee stuff for removing, and
remov by day in their sight; and thou shalt remov from thi place to
anoth place in their sight: it may be they will consider, though
they be a rebelli house.

12:4 then shalt thou bring forth thi stuff by day in their sight, as
stuff for removing: and thou shalt go forth at even in their sight, as
they that go forth into captivity.

12:5 dig thou through the wall in their sight, and carri out thereby.

12:6 In their sight shalt thou bear it upon thi shoulders, and carry
it forth in the twilight: thou shalt cover thi face, that thou see not
th ground: for I have set thee for a sign unto the hous of israel.

12:7 and I did so as I wa commanded: I brought forth my stuff by day,
a stuff for captivity, and in the even I dig through the wall with
min hand; I brought it forth in the twilight, and I bare it upon my
should in their sight.

12:8 and in the morn came the word of the lord unto me, saying,
12:9 son of man, hath not the hous of israel, the rebelli house,
said unto thee, what doest thou?  12:10 say thou unto them, thu saith
th lord god; thi burden concerneth the princ in jerusalem, and all
th hous of israel that are among them.

12:11 say, I am your sign: like as I have done, so shall it be done
unto them: they shall remov and go into captivity.

12:12 and the princ that is among them shall bear upon hi shoulder
in the twilight, and shall go forth: they shall dig through the wall
to carri out thereby: he shall cover hi face, that he see not the
ground with hi eyes.

12:13 My net also will I spread upon him, and he shall be taken in my
snare: and I will bring him to babylon to the land of the chaldeans;
yet shall he not see it, though he shall die there.

12:14 and I will scatter toward everi wind all that are about him to
help him, and all hi bands; and I will draw out the sword after them.

12:15 and they shall know that I am the lord, when I shall scatter
them among the nations, and dispers them in the countries.

12:16 but I will leav a few men of them from the sword, from the
famine, and from the pestilence; that they may declar all their
abomin among the heathen whither they come; and they shall know
that I am the lord.

12:17 moreov the word of the lord came to me, saying, 12:18 son of
man, eat thi bread with quaking, and drink thi water with trembling
and with carefulness; 12:19 and say unto the peopl of the land, thus
saith the lord god of the inhabit of jerusalem, and of the land of
israel; they shall eat their bread with carefulness, and drink their
wat with astonishment, that her land may be desol from all that
i therein, becaus of the violenc of all them that dwell therein.

12:20 and the citi that are inhabit shall be laid waste, and the
land shall be desolate; and ye shall know that I am the lord.

12:21 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 12:22 son of man,
what is that proverb that ye have in the land of israel, saying, the
day are prolonged, and everi vision faileth?  12:23 tell them
therefore, thu saith the lord god; I will make thi proverb to cease,
and they shall no more use it as a proverb in israel; but say unto
them, the day are at hand, and the effect of everi vision.

12:24 for there shall be no more ani vain vision nor flattering
divin within the hous of israel.

12:25 for I am the lord: I will speak, and the word that I shall speak
shal come to pass; it shall be no more prolonged: for in your days, o
rebelli house, will I say the word, and will perform it, saith the
lord god.

12:26 again the word of the lord came to me, saying.

12:27 son of man, behold, they of the hous of israel say, the vision
that he seeth is for mani day to come, and he prophesieth of the
tim that are far off.

12:28 therefor say unto them, thu saith the lord god; there shall
non of my word be prolong ani more, but the word which I have
spoken shall be done, saith the lord god.

13:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 13:2 son of man,
prophesi against the prophet of israel that prophesy, and say thou
unto them that prophesi out of their own hearts, hear ye the word of
th lord; 13:3 thu saith the lord god; woe unto the foolish prophets,
that follow their own spirit, and have seen nothing!  13:4 O israel,
thi prophet are like the fox in the deserts.

13:5 Ye have not gone up into the gaps, neither made up the hedg for
th hous of israel to stand in the battl in the day of the lord.

13:6 they have seen vaniti and lie divination, saying, the lord
saith: and the lord hath not sent them: and they have made other to
hop that they would confirm the word.

13:7 have ye not seen a vain vision, and have ye not spoken a lying
divination, wherea ye say, the lord saith it; albeit I have not
spoken?  13:8 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus ye have
spoken vanity, and seen lies, therefore, behold, I am against you,
saith the lord god.

13:9 and mine hand shall be upon the prophet that see vanity, and
that divin lies: they shall not be in the assembl of my people,
neith shall they be written in the write of the hous of israel,
neith shall they enter into the land of israel; and ye shall know
that I am the lord god.

13:10 because, even becaus they have seduc my people, saying,
peace; and there wa no peace; and one built up a wall, and, lo,
oth daub it with untemp morter: 13:11 say unto them which
daub it with untemp morter, that it shall fall: there shall be an
overflow shower; and ye, O great hailstones, shall fall; and a
stormi wind shall rend it.

13:12 lo, when the wall is fallen, shall it not be said unto you,
wher is the daub wherewith ye have daub it?  13:13 therefore
thu saith the lord god; I will even rend it with a stormi wind in my
fury; and there shall be an overflow shower in mine anger, and
great hailston in my furi to consum it.

13:14 So will I break down the wall that ye have daub with
untemp morter, and bring it down to the ground, so that the
found thereof shall be discovered, and it shall fall, and ye
shal be consum in the midst thereof: and ye shall know that I am
th lord.

13:15 thu will I accomplish my wrath upon the wall, and upon them
that have daub it with untemp morter, and will say unto you, the
wal is no more, neither they that daub it; 13:16 To wit, the
prophet of israel which prophesi concern jerusalem, and which see
vis of peac for her, and there is no peace, saith the lord god.

13:17 likewise, thou son of man, set thi face against the daughter of
thi people, which prophesi out of their own heart; and prophesi thou
against them, 13:18 and say, thu saith the lord god; woe to the women
that sew pillow to all armholes, and make kerchief upon the head of
everi statur to hunt souls! will ye hunt the soul of my people, and
wil ye save the soul aliv that come unto you?  13:19 and will ye
pollut me among my peopl for hand of barley and for piec of
bread, to slay the soul that should not die, and to save the souls
al that should not live, by your lie to my peopl that hear your
lies?  13:20 wherefor thu saith the lord god; behold, I am against
your pillows, wherewith ye there hunt the soul to make them fly, and
i will tear them from your arms, and will let the soul go, even the
soul that ye hunt to make them fly.

13:21 your kerchief also will I tear, and deliv my peopl out of
your hand, and they shall be no more in your hand to be hunted; and ye
shal know that I am the lord.

13:22 becaus with lie ye have made the heart of the righteou sad,
whom I have not made sad; and strengthen the hand of the wicked,
that he should not return from hi wick way, by promis him life:
13:23 therefor ye shall see no more vanity, nor divin divinations:
for I will deliv my peopl out of your hand: and ye shall know that
i am the lord.

14:1 then came certain of the elder of israel unto me, and sat before
me.

14:2 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 14:3 son of man,
thes men have set up their idol in their heart, and put the
stumblingblock of their iniqu befor their face: should I be
enquir of at all by them?  14:4 therefor speak unto them, and say
unto them, thu saith the lord god; everi man of the hous of israel
that setteth up hi idol in hi heart, and putteth the stumblingblock
of hi iniqu befor hi face, and cometh to the prophet; I the lord
wil answer him that cometh accord to the multitud of hi idols;
14:5 that I may take the hous of israel in their own heart, because
they are all estrang from me through their idols.

14:6 therefor say unto the hous of israel, thu saith the lord god;
repent, and turn yourselv from your idols; and turn away your faces
from all your abominations.

14:7 for everi one of the hous of israel, or of the stranger that
sojourneth in israel, which separateth himself from me, and setteth up
hi idol in hi heart, and putteth the stumblingblock of hi iniquity
befor hi face, and cometh to a prophet to enquir of him concerning
me; I the lord will answer him by myself: 14:8 and I will set my face
against that man, and will make him a sign and a proverb, and I will
cut him off from the midst of my people; and ye shall know that I am
th lord.

14:9 and if the prophet be deceiv when he hath spoken a thing, I the
lord have deceiv that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand upon
him, and will destroy him from the midst of my peopl israel.

14:10 and they shall bear the punish of their iniquity: the
punish of the prophet shall be even as the punish of him that
seeketh unto him; 14:11 that the hous of israel may go no more astray
from me, neither be pollut ani more with all their transgressions;
but that they may be my people, and I may be their god, saith the lord
god.

14:12 the word of the lord came again to me, saying, 14:13 son of man,
when the land sinneth against me by trespass grievously, then will
i stretch out mine hand upon it, and will break the staff of the bread
thereof, and will send famin upon it, and will cut off man and beast
from it: 14:14 though these three men, noah, daniel, and job, were in
it, they should deliv but their own soul by their righteousness,
saith the lord god.

14:15 If I caus noisom beast to pass through the land, and they
spoil it, so that it be desolate, that no man may pass through because
of the beasts: 14:16 though these three men were in it, as I live,
saith the lord god, they shall deliv neither son nor daughters;
they onli shall be delivered, but the land shall be desolate.

14:17 Or if I bring a sword upon that land, and say, sword, go through
th land; so that I cut off man and beast from it: 14:18 though these
thre men were in it, as I live, saith the lord god, they shall
deliv neither son nor daughters, but they onli shall be delivered
themselves.

14:19 Or if I send a pestil into that land, and pour out my fury
upon it in blood, to cut off from it man and beast: 14:20 though noah,
daniel, and job were in it, as I live, saith the lord god, they shall
deliv neither son nor daughter; they shall but deliv their own
soul by their righteousness.

14:21 for thu saith the lord god; how much more when I send my four
sor judgment upon jerusalem, the sword, and the famine, and the
noisom beast, and the pestilence, to cut off from it man and beast?
14:22 yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be
brought forth, both son and daughters: behold, they shall come forth
unto you, and ye shall see their way and their doings: and ye shall be
comfort concern the evil that I have brought upon jerusalem, even
concern all that I have brought upon it.

14:23 and they shall comfort you, when ye see their way and their
doings: and ye shall know that I have not done without caus all that
i have done in it, saith the lord god.

15:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 15:2 son of man,
what is the vine tree more than ani tree, or than a branch which is
among the tree of the forest?  15:3 shall wood be taken thereof to do
ani work? or will men take a pin of it to hang ani vessel thereon?
15:4 behold, it is cast into the fire for fuel; the fire devoureth
both the end of it, and the midst of it is burned. Is it meet for any
work?  15:5 behold, when it wa whole, it wa meet for no work: how
much less shall it be meet yet for ani work, when the fire hath
devour it, and it is burned?  15:6 therefor thu saith the lord
god; As the vine tree among the tree of the forest, which I have
given to the fire for fuel, so will I give the inhabit of
jerusalem.

15:7 and I will set my face against them; they shall go out from one
fire, and anoth fire shall devour them; and ye shall know that I am
th lord, when I set my face against them.

15:8 and I will make the land desolate, becaus they have commit a
trespass, saith the lord god.

16:1 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 16:2 son of man,
caus jerusalem to know her abominations, 16:3 and say, thu saith the
lord god unto jerusalem; thi birth and thi nativ is of the land of
canaan; thi father wa an amorite, and thi mother an hittite.

16:4 and as for thi nativity, in the day thou wast born thi navel was
not cut, neither wast thou wash in water to suppl thee; thou wast
not salt at all, nor swaddl at all.

16:5 none eye piti thee, to do ani of these unto thee, to have
compass upon thee; but thou wast cast out in the open field, to the
loth of thi person, in the day that thou wast born.

16:6 and when I pass by thee, and saw thee pollut in thine own
blood, I said unto thee when thou wast in thi blood, live; yea, I said
unto thee when thou wast in thi blood, live.

16:7 I have caus thee to multipli as the bud of the field, and thou
hast increas and waxen great, and thou art come to excellent
ornaments: thi breast are fashioned, and thine hair is grown, whereas
th wast nake and bare.

16:8 now when I pass by thee, and look upon thee, behold, thi time
wa the time of love; and I spread my skirt over thee, and cover thy
nakedness: yea, I sware unto thee, and enter into a coven with
thee, saith the lord god, and thou becamest mine.

16:9 then wash I thee with water; yea, I throughli wash away thy
blood from thee, and I anoint thee with oil.

16:10 I cloth thee also with broider work, and shod thee with
badgers' skin, and I gird thee about with fine linen, and I covered
the with silk.

16:11 I deck thee also with ornaments, and I put bracelet upon thy
hands, and a chain on thi neck.

16:12 and I put a jewel on thi forehead, and ear in thine ears,
and a beauti crown upon thine head.

16:13 thu wast thou deck with gold and silver; and thi raiment was
of fine linen, and silk, and broider work; thou didst eat fine
flour, and honey, and oil: and thou wast exceed beautiful, and thou
didst prosper into a kingdom.

16:14 and thi renown went forth among the heathen for thi beauty: for
it wa perfect through my comeliness, which I had put upon thee, saith
th lord god.

16:15 but thou didst trust in thine own beauty, and playedst the
harlot becaus of thi renown, and pouredst out thi fornic on
everi one that pass by; hi it was.

16:16 and of thi garment thou didst take, and deckedst thi high
plac with diver colours, and playedst the harlot thereupon: the
lik thing shall not come, neither shall it be so.

16:17 thou hast also taken thi fair jewel of my gold and of my
silver, which I had given thee, and madest to thyself imag of men,
and didst commit whoredom with them, 16:18 and tookest thi broidered
garments, and coveredst them: and thou hast set mine oil and mine
incens befor them.

16:19 My meat also which I gave thee, fine flour, and oil, and honey,
wherewith I fed thee, thou hast even set it befor them for a sweet
savour: and thu it was, saith the lord god.

16:20 moreov thou hast taken thi son and thi daughters, whom thou
hast born unto me, and these hast thou sacrif unto them to be
devoured. Is thi of thi whoredom a small matter, 16:21 that thou
hast slain my children, and deliv them to caus them to pass
through the fire for them?  16:22 and in all thine abomin and
thi whoredom thou hast not rememb the day of thi youth, when
thou wast nake and bare, and wast pollut in thi blood.

16:23 and it came to pass after all thi wickedness, (woe, woe unto
thee!  saith the lord god;) 16:24 that thou hast also built unto thee
an emin place, and hast made thee an high place in everi street.

16:25 thou hast built thi high place at everi head of the way, and
hast made thi beauti to be abhorred, and hast open thi feet to every
on that pass by, and multipli thi whoredoms.

16:26 thou hast also commit fornic with the egyptian thy
neighbours, great of flesh; and hast increas thi whoredoms, to
provok me to anger.

16:27 behold, therefor I have stretch out my hand over thee, and
hav diminish thine ordinari food, and deliv thee unto the will
of them that hate thee, the daughter of the philistines, which are
asham of thi lewd way.

16:28 thou hast play the whore also with the assyrians, becaus thou
wast unsatiable; yea, thou hast play the harlot with them, and yet
couldest not be satisfied.

16:29 thou hast moreov multipli thi fornic in the land of
canaan unto chaldea; and yet thou wast not satisfi therewith.

16:30 how weak is thine heart, saith the lord god, see thou doest
al these things, the work of an imperi whorish woman; 16:31 in
that thou buildest thine emin place in the head of everi way, and
makest thine high place in everi street; and hast not been as an
harlot, in that thou scornest hire; 16:32 but as a wife that
committeth adultery, which taketh stranger instead of her husband!
16:33 they give gift to all whores: but thou givest thi gift to all
thi lovers, and hirest them, that they may come unto thee on every
sid for thi whoredom.

16:34 and the contrari is in thee from other women in thi whoredoms,
wherea none followeth thee to commit whoredoms: and in that thou
givest a reward, and no reward is given unto thee, therefor thou art
contrary.

16:35 wherefore, O harlot, hear the word of the lord: 16:36 thu saith
th lord god; becaus thi filthi wa pour out, and thi nakedness
discov through thi whoredom with thi lovers, and with all the
idol of thi abominations, and by the blood of thi children, which
thou didst give unto them; 16:37 behold, therefor I will gather all
thi lovers, with whom thou hast taken pleasure, and all them that thou
hast loved, with all them that thou hast hated; I will even gather
them round about against thee, and will discov thi naked unto
them, that they may see all thi nakedness.

16:38 and I will judg thee, as women that break wedlock and shed
blood are judged; and I will give thee blood in furi and jealousy.

16:39 and I will also give thee into their hand, and they shall throw
down thine emin place, and shall break down thi high places: they
shal strip thee also of thi clothes, and shall take thi fair jewels,
and leav thee nake and bare.

16:40 they shall also bring up a compani against thee, and they shall
ston thee with stones, and thrust thee through with their swords.

16:41 and they shall burn thine hous with fire, and execute
judg upon thee in the sight of mani women: and I will caus thee
to ceas from play the harlot, and thou also shalt give no hire any
more.

16:42 So will I make my furi toward thee to rest, and my jealousy
shal depart from thee, and I will be quiet, and will be no more
angry.

16:43 becaus thou hast not rememb the day of thi youth, but hast
fret me in all these things; behold, therefor I also will
recompens thi way upon thine head, saith the lord god: and thou shalt
not commit thi lewd abov all thine abominations.

16:44 behold, everi one that useth proverb shall use thi proverb
against thee, saying, As is the mother, so is her daughter.

16:45 thou art thi mother' daughter, that lotheth her husband and her
children; and thou art the sister of thi sisters, which loth their
husband and their children: your mother wa an hittite, and your
fath an amorite.

16:46 and thine elder sister is samaria, she and her daughter that
dwel at thi left hand: and thi younger sister, that dwelleth at thy
right hand, is sodom and her daughters.

16:47 yet hast thou not walk after their ways, nor done after their
abominations: but, as if that were a veri littl thing, thou wast
corrupt more than they in all thi ways.

16:48 As I live, saith the lord god, sodom thi sister hath not done,
sh nor her daughters, as thou hast done, thou and thi daughters.

16:49 behold, thi wa the iniqu of thi sister sodom, pride,
 of bread, and abund of idl wa in her and in her
daughters, neither did she strengthen the hand of the poor and needy.

16:50 and they were haughty, and commit abomin befor me:
therefor I took them away as I saw good.

16:51 neither hath samaria commit half of thi sins; but thou hast
multipli thine abomin more than they, and hast justifi thy
sist in all thine abomin which thou hast done.

16:52 thou also, which hast judg thi sisters, bear thine own shame
for thi sin that thou hast commit more abomin than they: they
ar more righteou than thou: yea, be thou confound also, and bear
thi shame, in that thou hast justifi thi sisters.

16:53 when I shall bring again their captivity, the captiv of sodom
and her daughters, and the captiv of samaria and her daughters,
then will I bring again the captiv of thi captiv in the midst of
them: 16:54 that thou mayest bear thine own shame, and mayest be
confound in all that thou hast done, in that thou art a comfort unto
them.

16:55 when thi sisters, sodom and her daughters, shall return to their
form estate, and samaria and her daughter shall return to their
form estate, then thou and thi daughter shall return to your former
estate.

16:56 for thi sister sodom wa not mention by thi mouth in the day
of thi pride, 16:57 befor thi wicked wa discovered, as at the
tim of thi reproach of the daughter of syria, and all that are round
about her, the daughter of the philistines, which despis thee round
about.

16:58 thou hast born thi lewd and thine abominations, saith the
lord.

16:59 for thu saith the lord god; I will even deal with thee as thou
hast done, which hast despis the oath in break the covenant.

16:60 nevertheless I will rememb my coven with thee in the days
of thi youth, and I will establish unto thee an everlast covenant.

16:61 then thou shalt rememb thi ways, and be ashamed, when thou
shalt receiv thi sisters, thine elder and thi younger: and I will
giv them unto thee for daughters, but not by thi covenant.

16:62 and I will establish my coven with thee; and thou shalt know
that I am the lord: 16:63 that thou mayest remember, and be
confounded, and never open thi mouth ani more becaus of thi shame,
when I am pacifi toward thee for all that thou hast done, saith the
lord god.

17:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 17:2 son of man,
put forth a riddle, and speak a parabl unto the hous of israel; 17:3
and say, thu saith the lord god; A great eagl with great wings,
longwinged, full of feathers, which had diver colours, came unto
lebanon, and took the highest branch of the cedar: 17:4 He crop off
th top of hi young twigs, and carri it into a land of traffick; he
set it in a citi of merchants.

17:5 He took also of the seed of the land, and plant it in a
fruit field; he place it by great waters, and set it as a willow
tree.

17:6 and it grew, and becam a spread vine of low stature, whose
branch turn toward him, and the root thereof were under him: so
it becam a vine, and brought forth branches, and shot forth sprigs.

17:7 there wa also anoth great eagl with great wing and many
feathers: and, behold, thi vine did bend her root toward him, and
shot forth her branch toward him, that he might water it by the
furrow of her plantation.

17:8 It wa plant in a good soil by great waters, that it might
br forth branches, and that it might bear fruit, that it might be a
goodli vine.

17:9 say thou, thu saith the lord god; shall it prosper? shall he not
pul up the root thereof, and cut off the fruit thereof, that it
wither? it shall wither in all the leav of her spring, even without
great power or mani peopl to pluck it up by the root thereof.

17:10 yea, behold, be planted, shall it prosper? shall it not
utterli wither, when the east wind toucheth it? it shall wither in the
furrow where it grew.

17:11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 17:12 say
now to the rebelli house, know ye not what these thing mean?  tell
them, behold, the king of babylon is come to jerusalem, and hath taken
th king thereof, and the princ thereof, and led them with him to
babylon; 17:13 and hath taken of the king' seed, and made a covenant
with him, and hath taken an oath of him: he hath also taken the mighty
of the land: 17:14 that the kingdom might be base, that it might not
lift itself up, but that by keep of hi coven it might stand.

17:15 but he rebel against him in send hi ambassador into
egypt, that they might give him hors and much people. shall he
prosper? shall he escap that doeth such things? or shall he break the
covenant, and be delivered?  17:16 As I live, saith the lord god,
sur in the place where the king dwelleth that made him king, whose
oath he despised, and whose coven he brake, even with him in the
midst of babylon he shall die.

17:17 neither shall pharaoh with hi mighti armi and great company
mak for him in the war, by cast up mounts, and build forts, to
cut off mani persons: 17:18 see he despis the oath by breaking
th covenant, when, lo, he had given hi hand, and hath done all these
things, he shall not escape.

17:19 therefor thu saith the lord god; As I live, sure mine oath
that he hath despised, and my coven that he hath broken, even it
wil I recompens upon hi own head.

17:20 and I will spread my net upon him, and he shall be taken in my
snare, and I will bring him to babylon, and will plead with him there
for hi trespass that he hath trespass against me.

17:21 and all hi fugit with all hi band shall fall by the
sword, and they that remain shall be scatter toward all winds: and
y shall know that I the lord have spoken it.

17:22 thu saith the lord god; I will also take of the highest branch
of the high cedar, and will set it; I will crop off from the top of
hi young twig a tender one, and will plant it upon an high mountain
and eminent: 17:23 In the mountain of the height of israel will i
plant it: and it shall bring forth boughs, and bear fruit, and be a
goodli cedar: and under it shall dwell all fowl of everi wing; in the
shadow of the branch thereof shall they dwell.

17:24 and all the tree of the field shall know that I the lord have
brought down the high tree, have exalt the low tree, have dri up
th green tree, and have made the dri tree to flourish: I the lord
hav spoken and have done it.

18:1 the word of the lord came unto me again, saying, 18:2 what mean
ye, that ye use thi proverb concern the land of israel, saying,
th father have eaten sour grapes, and the children' teeth are set
on edge?  18:3 As I live, saith the lord god, ye shall not have
occas ani more to use thi proverb in israel.

18:4 behold, all soul are mine; as the soul of the father, so also
th soul of the son is mine: the soul that sinneth, it shall die.

18:5 but if a man be just, and do that which is law and right, 18:6
and hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lift up hi eyes
to the idol of the hous of israel, neither hath defil his
neighbour' wife, neither hath come near to a menstruou woman, 18:7
and hath not oppress any, but hath restor to the debtor his
pledge, hath spoil none by violence, hath given hi bread to the
hungry, and hath cover the nake with a garment; 18:8 He that hath
not given forth upon usury, neither hath taken ani increase, that hath
withdrawn hi hand from iniquity, hath execut true judgment between
man and man, 18:9 hath walk in my statutes, and hath kept my
judgments, to deal truly; he is just, he shall sure live, saith the
lord god.

18:10 If he beget a son that is a robber, a shedder of blood, and that
doeth the like to ani one of these things, 18:11 and that doeth not
ani of those duties, but even hath eaten upon the mountains, and
defil hi neighbour' wife, 18:12 hath oppress the poor and needy,
hath spoil by violence, hath not restor the pledge, and hath
lift up hi eye to the idols, hath commit abomination, 18:13
hath given forth upon usury, and hath taken increase: shall he then
live? he shall not live: he hath done all these abominations; he shall
sur die; hi blood shall be upon him.

18:14 now, lo, if he beget a son, that seeth all hi father' sins
which he hath done, and considereth, and doeth not such like, 18:15
that hath not eaten upon the mountains, neither hath lift up his
ey to the idol of the hous of israel, hath not defil his
neighbour' wife, 18:16 neither hath oppress any, hath not
withholden the pledge, neither hath spoil by violence, but hath
given hi bread to the hungry, and hath cover the nake with a
garment, 18:17 that hath taken off hi hand from the poor, that hath
not receiv usuri nor increase, hath execut my judgments, hath
walk in my statutes; he shall not die for the iniqu of his
father, he shall sure live.

18:18 As for hi father, becaus he cruelli oppressed, spoil his
broth by violence, and did that which is not good among hi people,
lo, even he shall die in hi iniquity.

18:19 yet say ye, why? doth not the son bear the iniqu of the
father?  when the son hath done that which is law and right, and
hath kept all my statutes, and hath done them, he shall sure live.

18:20 the soul that sinneth, it shall die. the son shall not bear the
iniqu of the father, neither shall the father bear the iniqu of
th son: the righteous of the righteou shall be upon him, and the
wicked of the wick shall be upon him.

18:21 but if the wick will turn from all hi sin that he hath
committed, and keep all my statutes, and do that which is law and
right, he shall sure live, he shall not die.

18:22 all hi transgress that he hath committed, they shall not be
ment unto him: in hi righteous that he hath done he shall
live.

18:23 have I ani pleasur at all that the wick should die? saith the
lord god: and not that he should return from hi ways, and live?
18:24 but when the righteou turneth away from hi righteousness, and
committeth iniquity, and doeth accord to all the abomin that
th wick man doeth, shall he live? all hi righteous that he
hath done shall not be mentioned: in hi trespass that he hath
trespassed, and in hi sin that he hath sinned, in them shall he die.

18:25 yet ye say, the way of the lord is not equal. hear now, O house
of israel; Is not my way equal? are not your way unequal?  18:26 when
a righteou man turneth away from hi righteousness, and committeth
iniquity, and dieth in them; for hi iniqu that he hath done shall
h die.

18:27 again, when the wick man turneth away from hi wicked that
h hath committed, and doeth that which is law and right, he shall
sav hi soul alive.

18:28 becaus he considereth, and turneth away from all his
transgress that he hath committed, he shall sure live, he shall
not die.

18:29 yet saith the hous of israel, the way of the lord is not equal.
o hous of israel, are not my way equal? are not your way unequal?
18:30 therefor I will judg you, O hous of israel, everi one
accord to hi ways, saith the lord god. repent, and turn yourselves
from all your transgressions; so iniqu shall not be your ruin.

18:31 cast away from you all your transgressions, wherebi ye have
transgressed; and make you a new heart and a new spirit: for whi will
y die, O hous of israel?  18:32 for I have no pleasur in the death
of him that dieth, saith the lord god: wherefor turn yourselves, and
liv ye.

19:1 moreov take thou up a lament for the princ of israel,
19:2 and say, what is thi mother? A lioness: she lay down among lions,
sh nourish her whelp among young lions.

19:3 and she brought up one of her whelps: it becam a young lion, and
it learn to catch the prey; it devour men.

19:4 the nation also heard of him; he wa taken in their pit, and
they brought him with chain unto the land of egypt.

19:5 now when she saw that she had waited, and her hope wa lost, then
sh took anoth of her whelps, and made him a young lion.

19:6 and he went up and down among the lions, he becam a young lion,
and learn to catch the prey, and devour men.

19:7 and he knew their desol palaces, and he laid wast their
cities; and the land wa desolate, and the ful thereof, by the
nois of hi roaring.

19:8 then the nation set against him on everi side from the
provinces, and spread their net over him: he wa taken in their pit.

19:9 and they put him in ward in chains, and brought him to the king
of babylon: they brought him into holds, that hi voic should no more
b heard upon the mountain of israel.

19:10 thi mother is like a vine in thi blood, plant by the waters:
sh wa fruit and full of branch by reason of mani waters.

19:11 and she had strong rod for the sceptr of them that bare rule,
and her statur wa exalt among the thick branches, and she appeared
in her height with the multitud of her branches.

19:12 but she wa pluck up in fury, she wa cast down to the ground,
and the east wind dri up her fruit: her strong rod were broken and
withered; the fire consum them.

19:13 and now she is plant in the wilderness, in a dri and thirsty
ground.

19:14 and fire is gone out of a rod of her branches, which hath
devour her fruit, so that she hath no strong rod to be a sceptr to
rule. thi is a lamentation, and shall be for a lamentation.

20:1 and it came to pass in the seventh year, in the fifth month, the
tenth day of the month, that certain of the elder of israel came to
enquir of the lord, and sat befor me.

20:2 then came the word of the lord unto me, saying, 20:3 son of man,
speak unto the elder of israel, and say unto them, thu saith the
lord god; are ye come to enquir of me? As I live, saith the lord god,
i will not be enquir of by you.

20:4 wilt thou judg them, son of man, wilt thou judg them? cause
them to know the abomin of their fathers: 20:5 and say unto
them, thu saith the lord god; In the day when I chose israel, and
lift up mine hand unto the seed of the hous of jacob, and made
myself known unto them in the land of egypt, when I lift up mine
hand unto them, saying, I am the lord your god; 20:6 In the day that i
lift up mine hand unto them, to bring them forth of the land of
egypt into a land that I had espi for them, flow with milk and
honey, which is the glori of all lands: 20:7 then said I unto them,
cast ye away everi man the abomin of hi eyes, and defil not
yourselv with the idol of egypt: I am the lord your god.

20:8 but they rebel against me, and would not hearken unto me: they
did not everi man cast away the abomin of their eyes, neither
did they forsak the idol of egypt: then I said, I will pour out my
furi upon them, to accomplish my anger against them in the midst of
th land of egypt.

20:9 but I wrought for my name' sake, that it should not be polluted
befor the heathen, among whom they were, in whose sight I made myself
known unto them, in bring them forth out of the land of egypt.

20:10 wherefor I caus them to go forth out of the land of egypt,
and brought them into the wilderness.

20:11 and I gave them my statutes, and shew them my judgments, which
if a man do, he shall even live in them.

20:12 moreov also I gave them my sabbaths, to be a sign between me
and them, that they might know that I am the lord that sanctifi them.

20:13 but the hous of israel rebel against me in the wilderness:
they walk not in my statutes, and they despis my judgments, which
if a man do, he shall even live in them; and my sabbath they greatly
polluted: then I said, I would pour out my furi upon them in the
wilderness, to consum them.

20:14 but I wrought for my name' sake, that it should not be polluted
befor the heathen, in whose sight I brought them out.

20:15 yet also I lift up my hand unto them in the wilderness, that i
would not bring them into the land which I had given them, flowing
with milk and honey, which is the glori of all lands; 20:16 because
they despis my judgments, and walk not in my statutes, but
pollut my sabbaths: for their heart went after their idols.

20:17 nevertheless mine eye spare them from destroy them, neither
did I make an end of them in the wilderness.

20:18 but I said unto their children in the wilderness, walk ye not in
th statut of your fathers, neither observ their judgments, nor
defil yourselv with their idols: 20:19 I am the lord your god; walk
in my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; 20:20 and hallow
mi sabbaths; and they shall be a sign between me and you, that ye may
know that I am the lord your god.

20:21 notwithstand the children rebel against me: they walked
not in my statutes, neither kept my judgment to do them, which if a
man do, he shall even live in them; they pollut my sabbaths: then i
said, I would pour out my furi upon them, to accomplish my anger
against them in the wilderness.

20:22 nevertheless I withdrew mine hand, and wrought for my name's
sake, that it should not be pollut in the sight of the heathen, in
whos sight I brought them forth.

20:23 I lift up mine hand unto them also in the wilderness, that i
would scatter them among the heathen, and dispers them through the
countries; 20:24 becaus they had not execut my judgments, but had
despis my statutes, and had pollut my sabbaths, and their eyes
wer after their fathers' idols.

20:25 wherefor I gave them also statut that were not good, and
judg wherebi they should not live; 20:26 and I pollut them in
their own gifts, in that they caus to pass through the fire all that
openeth the womb, that I might make them desolate, to the end that
they might know that I am the lord.

20:27 therefore, son of man, speak unto the hous of israel, and say
unto them, thu saith the lord god; yet in thi your father have
blasphem me, in that they have commit a trespass against me.

20:28 for when I had brought them into the land, for the which i
lift up mine hand to give it to them, then they saw everi high hill,
and all the thick trees, and they offer there their sacrifices, and
ther they present the provoc of their offering: there also
they made their sweet savour, and pour out there their drink
offerings.

20:29 then I said unto them, what is the high place whereunto ye go?
and the name whereof is call bamah unto thi day.

20:30 wherefor say unto the hous of israel, thu saith the lord god;
ar ye pollut after the manner of your fathers? and commit ye
whoredom after their abominations?  20:31 for when ye offer your
gifts, when ye make your son to pass through the fire, ye pollute
yourselv with all your idols, even unto thi day: and shall I be
enquir of by you, O hous of israel? As I live, saith the lord god,
i will not be enquir of by you.

20:32 and that which cometh into your mind shall not be at all, that
y say, We will be as the heathen, as the famili of the countries,
to serv wood and stone.

20:33 As I live, saith the lord god, sure with a mighti hand, and
with a stretch out arm, and with furi pour out, will I rule over
you: 20:34 and I will bring you out from the people, and will gather
y out of the countri wherein ye are scattered, with a mighti hand,
and with a stretch out arm, and with furi pour out.

20:35 and I will bring you into the wilder of the people, and
ther will I plead with you face to face.

20:36 like as I plead with your father in the wilder of the
land of egypt, so will I plead with you, saith the lord god.

20:37 and I will caus you to pass under the rod, and I will bring you
into the bond of the covenant: 20:38 and I will purg out from among
y the rebels, and them that transgress against me: I will bring them
forth out of the countri where they sojourn, and they shall not enter
into the land of israel: and ye shall know that I am the lord.

20:39 As for you, O hous of israel, thu saith the lord god; Go ye,
serv ye everi one hi idols, and hereaft also, if ye will not
hearken unto me: but pollut ye my holi name no more with your gifts,
and with your idols.

20:40 for in mine holi mountain, in the mountain of the height of
israel, saith the lord god, there shall all the hous of israel, all
of them in the land, serv me: there will I accept them, and there
wil I requir your offerings, and the firstfruit of your oblations,
with all your holi things.

20:41 I will accept you with your sweet savour, when I bring you out
from the people, and gather you out of the countri wherein ye have
been scattered; and I will be sanctifi in you befor the heathen.

20:42 and ye shall know that I am the lord, when I shall bring you
into the land of israel, into the countri for the which I lift up
min hand to give it to your fathers.

20:43 and there shall ye rememb your ways, and all your doings,
wherein ye have been defiled; and ye shall loth yourselv in your
own sight for all your evil that ye have committed.

20:44 and ye shall know that I am the lord when I have wrought with
you for my name' sake, not accord to your wick ways, nor
accord to your corrupt doings, O ye hous of israel, saith the lord
god.

20:45 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 20:46 son of
man, set thi face toward the south, and drop thi word toward the
south, and prophesi against the forest of the south field; 20:47 and
say to the forest of the south, hear the word of the lord; thu saith
th lord god; behold, I will kindl a fire in thee, and it shall
devour everi green tree in thee, and everi dri tree: the flame flame
shal not be quenched, and all face from the south to the north shall
b burn therein.

20:48 and all flesh shall see that I the lord have kindl it: it
shal not be quenched.

20:49 then said I, Ah lord god! they say of me, doth he not speak
parables?  21:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 21:2
son of man, set thi face toward jerusalem, and drop thi word toward
th holi places, and prophesi against the land of israel, 21:3 and say
to the land of israel, thu saith the lord; behold, I am against thee,
