and will draw forth my sword out of hi sheath, and will cut off from
the the righteou and the wicked.

21:4 see then that I will cut off from thee the righteou and the
wicked, therefor shall my sword go forth out of hi sheath against
al flesh from the south to the north: 21:5 that all flesh may know
that I the lord have drawn forth my sword out of hi sheath: it shall
not return ani more.

21:6 sigh therefore, thou son of man, with the break of thi loins;
and with bitter sigh befor their eyes.

21:7 and it shall be, when they say unto thee, wherefor sighest thou?
that thou shalt answer, for the tidings; becaus it cometh: and every
heart shall melt, and all hand shall be feeble, and everi spirit
shal faint, and all knee shall be weak as water: behold, it cometh,
and shall be brought to pass, saith the lord god.

21:8 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 21:9 son of man,
prophesy, and say, thu saith the lord; say, A sword, a sword is
sharpened, and also furbished: 21:10 It is sharpen to make a sore
slaughter; it is furbish that it may glitter: should we then make
mirth? it contemneth the rod of my son, as everi tree.

21:11 and he hath given it to be furbished, that it may be handled:
thi sword is sharpened, and it is furbished, to give it into the hand
of the slayer.

21:12 cri and howl, son of man: for it shall be upon my people, it
shal be upon all the princ of israel: terror by reason of the
sword shall be upon my people: smite therefor upon thi thigh.

21:13 becaus it is a trial, and what if the sword contemn even the
rod?  it shall be no more, saith the lord god.

21:14 thou therefore, son of man, prophesy, and smite thine hands
together. and let the sword be doubl the third time, the sword of
th slain: it is the sword of the great men that are slain, which
entereth into their privi chambers.

21:15 I have set the point of the sword against all their gates, that
their heart may faint, and their ruin be multiplied: ah! it is made
bright, it is wrap up for the slaughter.

21:16 Go thee one way or other, either on the right hand, or on the
left, whithersoev thi face is set.

21:17 I will also smite mine hand together, and I will caus my fury
to rest: I the lord have said it.

21:18 the word of the lord came unto me again, saying, 21:19 also,
th son of man, appoint thee two ways, that the sword of the king of
babylon may come: both twain shall come forth out of one land: and
choos thou a place, choos it at the head of the way to the city.

21:20 appoint a way, that the sword may come to rabbath of the
ammonites, and to judah in jerusalem the defenced.

21:21 for the king of babylon stood at the part of the way, at the
head of the two ways, to use divination: he made hi arrow bright, he
consult with images, he look in the liver.

21:22 At hi right hand wa the divin for jerusalem, to appoint
captains, to open the mouth in the slaughter, to lift up the voice
with shouting, to appoint batter ram against the gates, to cast a
mount, and to build a fort.

21:23 and it shall be unto them as a fals divin in their sight,
to them that have sworn oaths: but he will call to remembr the
iniquity, that they may be taken.

21:24 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus ye have made your
iniqu to be remembered, in that your transgress are discovered,
so that in all your do your sin do appear; because, I say, that
y are come to remembrance, ye shall be taken with the hand.

21:25 and thou, profan wick princ of israel, whose day is come,
when iniqu shall have an end, 21:26 thu saith the lord god; remove
th diadem, and take off the crown: thi shall not be the same: exalt
him that is low, and abas him that is high.

21:27 I will overturn, overturn, overturn, it: and it shall be no
more, until he come whose right it is; and I will give it him.

21:28 and thou, son of man, prophesi and say, thu saith the lord god
concern the ammonites, and concern their reproach; even say
thou, the sword, the sword is drawn: for the slaughter it is
furbished, to consum becaus of the glittering: 21:29 while they see
van unto thee, while they divin a lie unto thee, to bring thee
upon the neck of them that are slain, of the wicked, whose day is
come, when their iniqu shall have an end.

21:30 shall I caus it to return into hi sheath? I will judg thee in
th place where thou wast created, in the land of thi nativity.

21:31 and I will pour out mine indign upon thee, I will blow
against thee in the fire of my wrath, and deliv thee into the hand
of brutish men, and skil to destroy.

21:32 thou shalt be for fuel to the fire; thi blood shall be in the
midst of the land; thou shalt be no more remembered: for I the lord
hav spoken it.

22:1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 22:2 now,
thou son of man, wilt thou judge, wilt thou judg the bloodi city?
yea, thou shalt shew her all her abominations.

22:3 then say thou, thu saith the lord god, the citi sheddeth blood
in the midst of it, that her time may come, and maketh idol against
herself to defil herself.

22:4 thou art becom guilti in thi blood that thou hast shed; and hast
defil thyself in thine idol which thou hast made; and thou hast
caus thi day to draw near, and art come even unto thi years:
therefor have I made thee a reproach unto the heathen, and a mocking
to all countries.

22:5 those that be near, and those that be far from thee, shall mock
thee, which art infam and much vexed.

22:6 behold, the princ of israel, everi one were in thee to their
pow to shed blood.

22:7 In thee have they set light by father and mother: in the midst of
the have they dealt by oppress with the stranger: in thee have
they vex the fatherless and the widow.

22:8 thou hast despis mine holi things, and hast profan my
sabbaths.

22:9 In thee are men that carri tale to shed blood: and in thee they
eat upon the mountains: in the midst of thee they commit lewdness.

22:10 In thee have they discov their fathers' nakedness: in thee
hav they humbl her that wa set apart for pollution.

22:11 and one hath commit abomin with hi neighbour' wife;
and anoth hath lewdli defil hi daughter in law; and anoth in
the hath humbl hi sister, hi father' daughter.

22:12 In thee have they taken gift to shed blood; thou hast taken
usuri and increase, and thou hast greedili gain of thi neighbour by
extortion, and hast forgotten me, saith the lord god.

22:13 behold, therefor I have smitten mine hand at thi dishonest gain
which thou hast made, and at thi blood which hath been in the midst of
thee.

22:14 can thine heart endure, or can thine hand be strong, in the
day that I shall deal with thee? I the lord have spoken it, and will
do it.

22:15 and I will scatter thee among the heathen, and dispers thee in
th countries, and will consum thi filthi out of thee.

22:16 and thou shalt take thine inherit in thyself in the sight of
th heathen, and thou shalt know that I am the lord.

22:17 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 22:18 son of man,
th hous of israel is to me becom dross: all they are brass, and
tin, and iron, and lead, in the midst of the furnace; they are even
th dross of silver.

22:19 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus ye are all become
dross, behold, therefor I will gather you into the midst of
jerusalem.

22:20 As they gather silver, and brass, and iron, and lead, and tin,
into the midst of the furnace, to blow the fire upon it, to melt it;
so will I gather you in mine anger and in my fury, and I will leave
y there, and melt you.

22:21 yea, I will gather you, and blow upon you in the fire of my
wrath, and ye shall be melt in the midst therof.

22:22 As silver is melt in the midst of the furnace, so shall ye be
melt in the midst thereof; and ye shall know that I the lord have
pour out my furi upon you.

22:23 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 22:24 son of man,
say unto her, thou art the land that is not cleansed, nor rain upon
in the day of indignation.

22:25 there is a conspiraci of her prophet in the midst thereof, like
a roar lion raven the prey; they have devour souls; they have
taken the treasur and preciou things; they have made her mani widows
in the midst thereof.

22:26 her priest have violat my law, and have profan mine holy
things: they have put no differ between the holi and profane,
neith have they shew differ between the unclean and the clean,
and have hid their eye from my sabbaths, and I am profan among
them.

22:27 her princ in the midst thereof are like wolv raven the
prey, to shed blood, and to destroy souls, to get dishonest gain.

22:28 and her prophet have daub them with untemp morter, seeing
vanity, and divin lie unto them, saying, thu saith the lord god,
when the lord hath not spoken.

22:29 the peopl of the land have use oppression, and exercised
robbery, and have vex the poor and needy: yea, they have oppressed
th stranger wrongfully.

22:30 and I sought for a man among them, that should make up the
hedge, and stand in the gap befor me for the land, that I should not
destroy it: but I found none.

22:31 therefor have I pour out mine indign upon them; I have
consum them with the fire of my wrath: their own way have i
recompens upon their heads, saith the lord god.

23:1 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 23:2 son of man,
ther were two women, the daughter of one mother: 23:3 and they
commit whoredom in egypt; they commit whoredom in their youth:
ther were their breast pressed, and there they bruis the teat of
their virginity.

23:4 and the name of them were aholah the elder, and aholibah her
sister: and they were mine, and they bare son and daughters. thus
wer their names; samaria is aholah, and jerusalem aholibah.

23:5 and aholah play the harlot when she wa mine; and she dote on
her lovers, on the assyrian her neighbours, 23:6 which were clothed
with blue, captain and rulers, all of them desir young men,
horsemen ride upon horses.

23:7 thu she commit her whoredom with them, with all them that
wer the chosen men of assyria, and with all on whom she doted: with
al their idol she defil herself.

23:8 neither left she her whoredom brought from egypt: for in her
youth they lay with her, and they bruis the breast of her
virginity, and pour their whoredom upon her.

23:9 wherefor I have deliv her into the hand of her lovers, into
th hand of the assyrians, upon whom she doted.

23:10 these discov her nakedness: they took her son and her
daughters, and slew her with the sword: and she becam famou among
women; for they had execut judgment upon her.

23:11 and when her sister aholibah saw this, she wa more corrupt in
her inordin love than she, and in her whoredom more than her
sist in her whoredoms.

23:12 she dote upon the assyrian her neighbours, captain and rulers
cloth most gorgeously, horsemen ride upon horses, all of them
desir young men.

23:13 then I saw that she wa defiled, that they took both one way,
23:14 and that she increas her whoredoms: for when she saw men
pourtray upon the wall, the imag of the chaldean pourtray with
vermilion, 23:15 gird with girdl upon their loins, exceed in
di attir upon their heads, all of them princ to look to, after
th manner of the babylonian of chaldea, the land of their nativity:
23:16 and as soon as she saw them with her eyes, she dote upon them,
and sent messeng unto them into chaldea.

23:17 and the babylonian came to her into the bed of love, and they
defil her with their whoredom, and she wa pollut with them, and
her mind wa alien from them.

23:18 So she discov her whoredoms, and discov her nakedness:
then my mind wa alien from her, like as my mind wa alienated
from her sister.

23:19 yet she multipli her whoredoms, in call to remembr the
day of her youth, wherein she had play the harlot in the land of
egypt.

23:20 for she dote upon their paramours, whose flesh is as the flesh
of asses, and whose issu is like the issu of horses.

23:21 thu thou calledst to remembr the lewd of thi youth, in
bruis thi teat by the egyptian for the pap of thi youth.

23:22 therefore, O aholibah, thu saith the lord god; behold, I will
rais up thi lover against thee, from whom thi mind is alienated, and
i will bring them against thee on everi side; 23:23 the babylonians,
and all the chaldeans, pekod, and shoa, and koa, and all the assyrians
with them: all of them desir young men, captain and rulers, great
lord and renowned, all of them ride upon horses.

23:24 and they shall come against thee with chariots, wagons, and
wheels, and with an assembl of people, which shall set against thee
buckl and shield and helmet round about: and I will set judgment
befor them, and they shall judg thee accord to their judgments.

23:25 and I will set my jealousi against thee, and they shall deal
furi with thee: they shall take away thi nose and thine ears; and
thi remnant shall fall by the sword: they shall take thi son and thy
daughters; and thi residu shall be devour by the fire.

23:26 they shall also strip thee out of thi clothes, and take away thy
fair jewels.

23:27 thu will I make thi lewd to ceas from thee, and thy
whoredom brought from the land of egypt: so that thou shalt not lift
up thine eye unto them, nor rememb egypt ani more.

23:28 for thu saith the lord god; behold, I will deliv thee into
th hand of them whom thou hatest, into the hand of them from whom thy
mind is alienated: 23:29 and they shall deal with thee hatefully, and
shal take away all thi labour, and shall leav thee nake and bare:
and the naked of thi whoredom shall be discovered, both thy
lewd and thi whoredoms.

23:30 I will do these thing unto thee, becaus thou hast gone a
whor after the heathen, and becaus thou art pollut with their
idols.

23:31 thou hast walk in the way of thi sister; therefor will I give
h cup into thine hand.

23:32 thu saith the lord god; thou shalt drink of thi sister' cup
deep and large: thou shalt be laugh to scorn and had in derision; it
containeth much.

23:33 thou shalt be fill with drunken and sorrow, with the cup
of astonish and desolation, with the cup of thi sister samaria.

23:34 thou shalt even drink it and suck it out, and thou shalt break
th sherd thereof, and pluck off thine own breasts: for I have spoken
it, saith the lord god.

23:35 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast forgotten
me, and cast me behind thi back, therefor bear thou also thi lewdness
and thi whoredoms.

23:36 the lord said moreov unto me; son of man, wilt thou judge
aholah and aholibah? yea, declar unto them their abominations; 23:37
that they have commit adultery, and blood is in their hands, and
with their idol have they commit adultery, and have also caused
their sons, whom they bare unto me, to pass for them through the fire,
to devour them.

23:38 moreov thi they have done unto me: they have defil my
sanctuari in the same day, and have profan my sabbaths.

23:39 for when they had slain their children to their idols, then they
cam the same day into my sanctuari to profan it; and, lo, thu have
they done in the midst of mine house.

23:40 and furthermore, that ye have sent for men to come from far,
unto whom a messeng wa sent; and, lo, they came: for whom thou
didst wash thyself, paintedst thi eyes, and deckedst thyself with
ornaments, 23:41 and satest upon a state bed, and a tabl prepared
befor it, whereupon thou hast set mine incens and mine oil.

23:42 and a voic of a multitud be at eas wa with her: and with
th men of the common sort were brought sabean from the wilderness,
which put bracelet upon their hands, and beauti crown upon their
heads.

23:43 then said I unto her that wa old in adulteries, will they now
commit whoredom with her, and she with them?  23:44 yet they went in
unto her, as they go in unto a woman that playeth the harlot: so went
they in unto aholah and unto aholibah, the lewd women.

23:45 and the righteou men, they shall judg them after the manner of
adulteresses, and after the manner of women that shed blood; because
they are adulteresses, and blood is in their hands.

23:46 for thu saith the lord god; I will bring up a compani upon
them, and will give them to be remov and spoiled.

23:47 and the compani shall stone them with stones, and dispatch them
with their swords; they shall slay their son and their daughters, and
burn up their hous with fire.

23:48 thu will I caus lewd to ceas out of the land, that all
women may be taught not to do after your lewdness.

23:49 and they shall recompens your lewd upon you, and ye shall
bear the sin of your idols: and ye shall know that I am the lord god.

24:1 again in the ninth year, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of
th month, the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 24:2 son of man,
writ thee the name of the day, even of thi same day: the king of
babylon set himself against jerusalem thi same day.

24:3 and utter a parabl unto the rebelli house, and say unto them,
thu saith the lord god; set on a pot, set it on, and also pour water
into it: 24:4 gather the piec thereof into it, even everi good
piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fill it with the choic bones.

24:5 take the choic of the flock, and burn also the bone under it,
and make it boil well, and let them seeth the bone of it therein.

24:6 wherefor thu saith the lord god; woe to the bloodi city, to the
pot whose scum is therein, and whose scum is not gone out of it! bring
it out piec by piece; let no lot fall upon it.

24:7 for her blood is in the midst of her; she set it upon the top of
a rock; she pour it not upon the ground, to cover it with dust; 24:8
that it might caus furi to come up to take vengeance; I have set her
blood upon the top of a rock, that it should not be covered.

24:9 therefor thu saith the lord god; woe to the bloodi city! I will
even make the pile for fire great.

24:10 heap on wood, kindl the fire, consum the flesh, and spice it
well, and let the bone be burned.

24:11 then set it empti upon the coal thereof, that the brass of it
may be hot, and may burn, and that the filthi of it may be molten
in it, that the scum of it may be consumed.

24:12 she hath weari herself with lies, and her great scum went not
forth out of her: her scum shall be in the fire.

24:13 In thi filthi is lewdness: becaus I have purg thee, and
thou wast not purged, thou shalt not be purg from thi filthi any
more, till I have caus my furi to rest upon thee.

24:14 I the lord have spoken it: it shall come to pass, and I will do
it; I will not go back, neither will I spare, neither will I repent;
accord to thi ways, and accord to thi doings, shall they judge
thee, saith the lord god.

24:15 also the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 24:16 son of
man, behold, I take away from thee the desir of thine eye with a
stroke: yet neither shalt thou mourn nor weep, neither shall thi tears
run down.

24:17 forbear to cry, make no mourn for the dead, bind the tire of
thin head upon thee, and put on thi shoe upon thi feet, and cover
not thi lips, and eat not the bread of men.

24:18 So I spake unto the peopl in the morning: and at even my wife
died; and I did in the morn as I wa commanded.

24:19 and the peopl said unto me, wilt thou not tell us what these
th are to us, that thou doest so?  24:20 then I answer them, the
word of the lord came unto me, saying, 24:21 speak unto the hous of
israel, thu saith the lord god; behold, I will profan my sanctuary,
th excel of your strength, the desir of your eyes, and that
which your soul pitieth; and your son and your daughter whom ye have
left shall fall by the sword.

24:22 and ye shall do as I have done: ye shall not cover your lips,
nor eat the bread of men.

24:23 and your tire shall be upon your heads, and your shoe upon
your feet: ye shall not mourn nor weep; but ye shall pine away for
your iniquities, and mourn one toward another.

24:24 thu ezekiel is unto you a sign: accord to all that he hath
don shall ye do: and when thi cometh, ye shall know that I am the
lord god.

24:25 also, thou son of man, shall it not be in the day when I take
from them their strength, the joy of their glory, the desir of their
eyes, and that whereupon they set their minds, their son and their
daughters, 24:26 that he that escapeth in that day shall come unto
thee, to caus thee to hear it with thine ears?  24:27 In that day
shal thi mouth be open to him which is escaped, and thou shalt
speak, and be no more dumb: and thou shalt be a sign unto them; and
they shall know that I am the lord.

25:1 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 25:2 son of man,
set thi face against the ammonites, and prophesi against them; 25:3
and say unto the ammonites, hear the word of the lord god; thu saith
th lord god; becaus thou saidst, aha, against my sanctuary, when it
wa profaned; and against the land of israel, when it wa desolate;
and against the hous of judah, when they went into captivity; 25:4
behold, therefor I will deliv thee to the men of the east for a
possession, and they shall set their palac in thee, and make their
dwel in thee: they shall eat thi fruit, and they shall drink thy
milk.

25:5 and I will make rabbah a stabl for camels, and the ammonit a
couch place for flocks: and ye shall know that I am the lord.

25:6 for thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast clap thine
hands, and stamp with the feet, and rejoic in heart with all thy
despit against the land of israel; 25:7 behold, therefor I will
stretch out mine hand upon thee, and will deliv thee for a spoil to
th heathen; and I will cut thee off from the people, and I will cause
the to perish out of the countries: I will destroy thee; and thou
shalt know that I am the lord.

25:8 thu saith the lord god; becaus that moab and seir do say,
behold, the hous of judah is like unto all the heathen; 25:9
therefore, behold, I will open the side of moab from the cities, from
hi citi which are on hi frontiers, the glori of the country,
bethjeshimoth, baalmeon, and kiriathaim, 25:10 unto the men of the
east with the ammonites, and will give them in possession, that the
ammonit may not be rememb among the nations.

25:11 and I will execut judgment upon moab; and they shall know that
i am the lord.

25:12 thu saith the lord god; becaus that edom hath dealt against
th hous of judah by take vengeance, and hath greatli offended, and
reveng himself upon them; 25:13 therefor thu saith the lord god; i
wil also stretch out mine hand upon edom, and will cut off man and
beast from it; and I will make it desol from teman; and they of
dedan shall fall by the sword.

25:14 and I will lay my vengeanc upon edom by the hand of my people
israel: and they shall do in edom accord to mine anger and
accord to my fury; and they shall know my vengeance, saith the lord
god.

25:15 thu saith the lord god; becaus the philistin have dealt by
revenge, and have taken vengeanc with a despit heart, to destroy
it for the old hatred; 25:16 therefor thu saith the lord god;
behold, I will stretch out mine hand upon the philistines, and I will
cut off the cherethims, and destroy the remnant of the sea coast.

25:17 and I will execut great vengeanc upon them with furious
rebukes; and they shall know that I am the lord, when I shall lay my
veng upon them.

26:1 and it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first day of the
month, that the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 26:2 son of
man, becaus that tyru hath said against jerusalem, aha, she is
broken that wa the gate of the people: she is turn unto me: i
shal be replenished, now she is laid waste: 26:3 therefor thu saith
th lord god; behold, I am against thee, O tyrus, and will caus many
n to come up against thee, as the sea causeth hi wave to come
up.

26:4 and they shall destroy the wall of tyrus, and break down her
towers: I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her like the
top of a rock.

26:5 It shall be a place for the spread of net in the midst of the
sea: for I have spoken it, saith the lord god: and it shall becom a
spoil to the nations.

26:6 and her daughter which are in the field shall be slain by the
sword; and they shall know that I am the lord.

26:7 for thu saith the lord god; behold, I will bring upon tyrus
nebuchadrezzar king of babylon, a king of kings, from the north, with
horses, and with chariots, and with horsemen, and companies, and much
people.

26:8 He shall slay with the sword thi daughter in the field: and he
shal make a fort against thee, and cast a mount against thee, and
lift up the buckler against thee.

26:9 and he shall set engin of war against thi walls, and with his
ax he shall break down thi towers.

26:10 By reason of the abund of hi hors their dust shall cover
thee: thi wall shall shake at the nois of the horsemen, and of the
wheels, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into thi gates, as
men enter into a citi wherein is made a breach.

26:11 with the hoof of hi hors shall he tread down all thy
streets: he shall slay thi peopl by the sword, and thi strong
garrison shall go down to the ground.

26:12 and they shall make a spoil of thi riches, and make a prey of
thi merchandise: and they shall break down thi walls, and destroy thy
pleas houses: and they shall lay thi stone and thi timber and thy
dust in the midst of the water.

26:13 and I will caus the nois of thi song to cease; and the sound
of thi harp shall be no more heard.

26:14 and I will make thee like the top of a rock: thou shalt be a
plac to spread net upon; thou shalt be built no more: for I the lord
hav spoken it, saith the lord god.

26:15 thu saith the lord god to tyrus; shall not the isl shake at
th sound of thi fall, when the wound cry, when the slaughter is
mad in the midst of thee?  26:16 then all the princ of the sea
shal come down from their thrones, and lay away their robes, and put
off their broider garments: they shall cloth themselv with
trembling; they shall sit upon the ground, and shall trembl at every
moment, and be astonish at thee.

26:17 and they shall take up a lament for thee, and say to thee,
how art thou destroyed, that wast inhabit of seafar men, the
renown city, which wast strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants,
which caus their terror to be on all that haunt it!  26:18 now shall
th isl trembl in the day of thi fall; yea, the isl that are in
th sea shall be troubl at thi departure.

26:19 for thu saith the lord god; when I shall make thee a desolate
city, like the citi that are not inhabited; when I shall bring up
th deep upon thee, and great water shall cover thee; 26:20 when i
shal bring thee down with them that descend into the pit, with the
peopl of old time, and shall set thee in the low part of the earth,
in place desol of old, with them that go down to the pit, that
thou be not inhabited; and I shall set glori in the land of the
living; 26:21 I will make thee a terror, and thou shalt be no more:
though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never be found again, saith
th lord god.

27:1 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 27:2 now, thou
son of man, take up a lament for tyrus; 27:3 and say unto tyrus,
o thou that art situat at the entri of the sea, which art a merchant
of the peopl for mani isles, thu saith the lord god; O tyrus, thou
hast said, I am of perfect beauty.

27:4 thi border are in the midst of the seas, thi builder have
perfect thi beauty.

27:5 they have made all thi ship board of fir tree of senir: they
hav taken cedar from lebanon to make mast for thee.

27:6 Of the oak of bashan have they made thine oars; the compani of
th ashurit have made thi bench of ivory, brought out of the isles
of chittim.

27:7 fine linen with broider work from egypt wa that which thou
spreadest forth to be thi sail; blue and purpl from the isl of
elishah wa that which cover thee.

27:8 the inhabit of zidon and arvad were thi mariners: thi wise
men, O tyrus, that were in thee, were thi pilots.

27:9 the ancient of gebal and the wise men thereof were in thee thy
calkers: all the ship of the sea with their marin were in thee to
occupi thi merchandise.

27:10 they of persia and of lud and of phut were in thine army, thy
men of war: they hang the shield and helmet in thee; they set forth
thi comeliness.

27:11 the men of arvad with thine armi were upon thi wall round
about, and the gammadim were in thi towers: they hang their shields
upon thi wall round about; they have made thi beauti perfect.

27:12 tarshish wa thi merchant by reason of the multitud of all kind
of riches; with silver, iron, tin, and lead, they trade in thi fairs.

27:13 javan, tubal, and meshech, they were thi merchants: they traded
th person of men and vessel of brass in thi market.

27:14 they of the hous of togarmah trade in thi fair with horses
and horsemen and mules.

27:15 the men of dedan were thi merchants; mani isl were the
merchandis of thine hand: they brought thee for a present horn of
ivori and ebony.

27:16 syria wa thi merchant by reason of the multitud of the wares
of thi making: they occupi in thi fair with emeralds, purple, and
broid work, and fine linen, and coral, and agate.

27:17 judah, and the land of israel, they were thi merchants: they
trad in thi market wheat of minnith, and pannag, and honey, and oil,
and balm.

27:18 damascu wa thi merchant in the multitud of the ware of thy
making, for the multitud of all riches; in the wine of helbon, and
whit wool.

27:19 dan also and javan go to and fro occupi in thi fairs:
bright iron, cassia, and calamus, were in thi market.

27:20 dedan wa thi merchant in preciou cloth for chariots.

27:21 arabia, and all the princ of kedar, they occupi with thee in
lambs, and rams, and goats: in these were they thi merchants.

27:22 the merchant of sheba and raamah, they were thi merchants: they
occupi in thi fair with chief of all spices, and with all precious
stones, and gold.

27:23 haran, and canneh, and eden, the merchant of sheba, asshur, and
chilmad, were thi merchants.

27:24 these were thi merchant in all sort of things, in blue
clothes, and broider work, and in chest of rich apparel, bound with
cords, and made of cedar, among thi merchandise.

27:25 the ship of tarshish did sing of thee in thi market: and thou
wast replenished, and made veri gloriou in the midst of the seas.

27:26 thi rower have brought thee into great waters: the east wind
hath broken thee in the midst of the seas.

27:27 thi riches, and thi fairs, thi merchandise, thi mariners, and
thi pilots, thi calkers, and the occupi of thi merchandise, and all
thi men of war, that are in thee, and in all thi compani which is in
th midst of thee, shall fall into the midst of the sea in the day of
thi ruin.

27:28 the suburb shall shake at the sound of the cri of thi pilots.

27:29 and all that handl the oar, the mariners, and all the pilot of
th sea, shall come down from their ships, they shall stand upon the
land; 27:30 and shall caus their voic to be heard against thee, and
shal cri bitterly, and shall cast up dust upon their heads, they
shal wallow themselv in the ashes: 27:31 and they shall make
themselv utterli bald for thee, and gird them with sackcloth, and
they shall weep for thee with bitter of heart and bitter wailing.

27:32 and in their wail they shall take up a lament for thee,
and lament over thee, saying, what citi is like tyrus, like the
destroy in the midst of the sea?  27:33 when thi ware went forth
out of the seas, thou filledst mani people; thou didst enrich the
k of the earth with the multitud of thi rich and of thy
merchandise.

27:34 In the time when thou shalt be broken by the sea in the depths
of the water thi merchandis and all thi compani in the midst of thee
shal fall.

27:35 all the inhabit of the isl shall be astonish at thee,
and their king shall be sore afraid, they shall be troubl in their
countenance.

27:36 the merchant among the peopl shall hiss at thee; thou shalt be
a terror, and never shalt be ani more.

28:1 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 28:2 son of man,
say unto the princ of tyrus, thu saith the lord god; becaus thine
heart is lift up, and thou hast said, I am a god, I sit in the seat
of god, in the midst of the seas; yet thou art a man, and not god,
though thou set thine heart as the heart of god: 28:3 behold, thou art
wis than daniel; there is no secret that they can hide from thee:
28:4 with thi wisdom and with thine understand thou hast gotten
the riches, and hast gotten gold and silver into thi treasures: 28:5
bi thi great wisdom and by thi traffick hast thou increas thy
riches, and thine heart is lift up becaus of thi riches: 28:6
therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast set thine heart
a the heart of god; 28:7 behold, therefor I will bring strangers
upon thee, the terribl of the nations: and they shall draw their
sword against the beauti of thi wisdom, and they shall defil thy
brightness.

28:8 they shall bring thee down to the pit, and thou shalt die the
death of them that are slain in the midst of the seas.

28:9 wilt thou yet say befor him that slayeth thee, I am god? but
thou shalt be a man, and no god, in the hand of him that slayeth thee.

28:10 thou shalt die the death of the uncircumcis by the hand of
strangers: for I have spoken it, saith the lord god.

28:11 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 28:12 son of
man, take up a lament upon the king of tyrus, and say unto him,
thu saith the lord god; thou sealest up the sum, full of wisdom, and
perfect in beauty.

28:13 thou hast been in eden the garden of god; everi preciou stone
wa thi covering, the sardius, topaz, and the diamond, the beryl, the
onyx, and the jasper, the sapphire, the emerald, and the carbuncle,
and gold: the workmanship of thi tabret and of thi pipe wa prepared
in thee in the day that thou wast created.

28:14 thou art the anoint cherub that covereth; and I have set thee
so: thou wast upon the holi mountain of god; thou hast walk up and
down in the midst of the stone of fire.

28:15 thou wast perfect in thi way from the day that thou wast
created, till iniqu wa found in thee.

28:16 By the multitud of thi merchandis they have fill the midst
of thee with violence, and thou hast sinned: therefor I will cast
the as profan out of the mountain of god: and I will destroy thee, o
cov cherub, from the midst of the stone of fire.

28:17 thine heart wa lift up becaus of thi beauty, thou hast
corrupt thi wisdom by reason of thi brightness: I will cast thee to
th ground, I will lay thee befor kings, that they may behold thee.

28:18 thou hast defil thi sanctuari by the multitud of thine
iniquities, by the iniqu of thi traffick; therefor will I bring
forth a fire from the midst of thee, it shall devour thee, and I will
br thee to ash upon the earth in the sight of all them that
behold thee.

28:19 all they that know thee among the peopl shall be astonish at
thee: thou shalt be a terror, and never shalt thou be ani more.

28:20 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 28:21 son of
man, set thi face against zidon, and prophesi against it, 28:22 and
say, thu saith the lord god; behold, I am against thee, O zidon; and
i will be glorifi in the midst of thee: and they shall know that i
am the lord, when I shall have execut judgment in her, and shall be
sanctifi in her.

28:23 for I will send into her pestilence, and blood into her streets;
and the wound shall be judg in the midst of her by the sword upon
h on everi side; and they shall know that I am the lord.

28:24 and there shall be no more a prick brier unto the hous of
israel, nor ani griev thorn of all that are round about them, that
despis them; and they shall know that I am the lord god.

28:25 thu saith the lord god; when I shall have gather the hous of
israel from the peopl among whom they are scattered, and shall be
sanctifi in them in the sight of the heathen, then shall they dwell
in their land that I have given to my servant jacob.

28:26 and they shall dwell safe therein, and shall build houses, and
plant vineyards; yea, they shall dwell with confidence, when I have
execut judgment upon all those that despis them round about them;
and they shall know that I am the lord their god.

29:1 In the tenth year, in the tenth month, in the twelfth day of the
month, the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 29:2 son of man, set
thi face against pharaoh king of egypt, and prophesi against him, and
against all egypt: 29:3 speak, and say, thu saith the lord god;
behold, I am against thee, pharaoh king of egypt, the great dragon
that lieth in the midst of hi rivers, which hath said, My river is
min own, and I have made it for myself.

29:4 but I will put hook in thi jaws, and I will caus the fish of
thi river to stick unto thi scales, and I will bring thee up out of
th midst of thi rivers, and all the fish of thi river shall stick
unto thi scales.

29:5 and I will leav thee thrown into the wilderness, thee and all
th fish of thi rivers: thou shalt fall upon the open fields; thou
shalt not be brought together, nor gathered: I have given thee for
meat to the beast of the field and to the fowl of the heaven.

29:6 and all the inhabit of egypt shall know that I am the lord,
becaus they have been a staff of reed to the hous of israel.

29:7 when they took hold of thee by thi hand, thou didst break, and
rend all their shoulder: and when they lean upon thee, thou brakest,
and madest all their loin to be at a stand.

29:8 therefor thu saith the lord god; behold, I will bring a sword
upon thee, and cut off man and beast out of thee.

29:9 and the land of egypt shall be desol and waste; and they shall
know that I am the lord: becaus he hath said, the river is mine, and
i have made it.

29:10 behold, therefor I am against thee, and against thi rivers, and
i will make the land of egypt utterli wast and desolate, from the
tow of syen even unto the border of ethiopia.

29:11 No foot of man shall pass through it, nor foot of beast shall
pass through it, neither shall it be inhabit forti years.

29:12 and I will make the land of egypt desol in the midst of the
countri that are desolate, and her citi among the citi that are
laid wast shall be desol forti years: and I will scatter the
egyptian among the nations, and will dispers them through the
countries.

29:13 yet thu saith the lord god; At the end of forti year will i
gath the egyptian from the peopl whither they were scattered:
29:14 and I will bring again the captiv of egypt, and will cause
them to return into the land of pathros, into the land of their
habitation; and they shall be there a base kingdom.

29:15 It shall be the basest of the kingdoms; neither shall it exalt
itself ani more abov the nations: for I will diminish them, that they
shal no more rule over the nations.

29:16 and it shall be no more the confid of the hous of israel,
which bringeth their iniqu to remembrance, when they shall look
aft them: but they shall know that I am the lord god.

29:17 and it came to pass in the seven and twentieth year, in the
first month, in the first day of the month, the word of the lord came
unto me, saying, 29:18 son of man, nebuchadrezzar king of babylon
caus hi armi to serv a great servic against tyrus: everi head was
mad bald, and everi shoulder wa peeled: yet had he no wages, nor his
army, for tyrus, for the servic that he had serv against it: 29:19
therefor thu saith the lord god; behold, I will give the land of
egypt unto nebuchadrezzar king of babylon; and he shall take her
multitude, and take her spoil, and take her prey; and it shall be the
wag for hi army.

29:20 I have given him the land of egypt for hi labour wherewith he
serv against it, becaus they wrought for me, saith the lord god.

29:21 In that day will I caus the horn of the hous of israel to bud
forth, and I will give thee the open of the mouth in the midst of
them; and they shall know that I am the lord.

30:1 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 30:2 son of man,
prophesi and say, thu saith the lord god; howl ye, woe worth the day!
30:3 for the day is near, even the day of the lord is near, a cloudy
day; it shall be the time of the heathen.

30:4 and the sword shall come upon egypt, and great pain shall be in
ethiopia, when the slain shall fall in egypt, and they shall take away
h multitude, and her foundat shall be broken down.

30:5 ethiopia, and libya, and lydia, and all the mingl people, and
chub, and the men of the land that is in league, shall fall with them
bi the sword.

30:6 thu saith the lord; they also that uphold egypt shall fall; and
th pride of her power shall come down: from the tower of syen shall
they fall in it by the sword, saith the lord god.

30:7 and they shall be desol in the midst of the countri that are
desolate, and her citi shall be in the midst of the citi that are
wasted.

30:8 and they shall know that I am the lord, when I have set a fire in
egypt, and when all her helper shall be destroyed.

30:9 In that day shall messeng go forth from me in ship to make
th careless ethiopian afraid, and great pain shall come upon them,
a in the day of egypt: for, lo, it cometh.

30:10 thu saith the lord god; I will also make the multitud of egypt
to ceas by the hand of nebuchadrezzar king of babylon.

30:11 He and hi peopl with him, the terribl of the nations, shall
b brought to destroy the land: and they shall draw their swords
against egypt, and fill the land with the slain.

30:12 and I will make the river dry, and sell the land into the hand
of the wicked: and I will make the land waste, and all that is
therein, by the hand of strangers: I the lord have spoken it.

30:13 thu saith the lord god; I will also destroy the idols, and i
wil caus their imag to ceas out of noph; and there shall be no
mor a princ of the land of egypt: and I will put a fear in the land
of egypt.

30:14 and I will make pathro desolate, and will set fire in zoan, and
wil execut judgment in no.

30:15 and I will pour my furi upon sin, the strength of egypt; and i
wil cut off the multitud of no.

30:16 and I will set fire in egypt: sin shall have great pain, and no
shal be rent asunder, and noph shall have distress daily.

30:17 the young men of aven and of pibeseth shall fall by the sword:
and these citi shall go into captivity.

30:18 At tehaphneh also the day shall be darkened, when I shall
break there the yoke of egypt: and the pomp of her strength shall
ceas in her: as for her, a cloud shall cover her, and her daughters
shal go into captivity.

30:19 thu will I execut judgment in egypt: and they shall know that
i am the lord.

30:20 and it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first month, in
th seventh day of the month, that the word of the lord came unto me,
saying, 30:21 son of man, I have broken the arm of pharaoh king of
egypt; and, lo, it shall not be bound up to be healed, to put a roller
to bind it, to make it strong to hold the sword.

30:22 therefor thu saith the lord god; behold, I am against pharaoh
k of egypt, and will break hi arms, the strong, and that which was
broken; and I will caus the sword to fall out of hi hand.

30:23 and I will scatter the egyptian among the nations, and will
dispers them through the countries.

30:24 and I will strengthen the arm of the king of babylon, and put
mi sword in hi hand: but I will break pharaoh' arms, and he shall
groan befor him with the groan of a deadli wound man.

30:25 but I will strengthen the arm of the king of babylon, and the
arm of pharaoh shall fall down; and they shall know that I am the
lord, when I shall put my sword into the hand of the king of babylon,
and he shall stretch it out upon the land of egypt.

30:26 and I will scatter the egyptian among the nations, and disperse
them among the countries; and they shall know that I am the lord.

31:1 and it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month, in
th first day of the month, that the word of the lord came unto me,
saying, 31:2 son of man, speak unto pharaoh king of egypt, and to his
multitude; whom art thou like in thi greatness?  31:3 behold, the
assyrian wa a cedar in lebanon with fair branches, and with a
shadow shroud, and of an high stature; and hi top wa among the
thick boughs.

31:4 the water made him great, the deep set him up on high with her
riv run round about hi plants, and sent her littl river unto
al the tree of the field.

31:5 therefor hi height wa exalt abov all the tree of the
field, and hi bough were multiplied, and hi branch becam long
becaus of the multitud of waters, when he shot forth.

31:6 all the fowl of heaven made their nest in hi boughs, and under
hi branch did all the beast of the field bring forth their young,
and under hi shadow dwelt all great nations.

31:7 thu wa he fair in hi greatness, in the length of hi branches:
for hi root wa by great waters.

31:8 the cedar in the garden of god could not hide him: the fir trees
wer not like hi boughs, and the chestnut tree were not like his
branches; nor ani tree in the garden of god wa like unto him in his
beauty.

31:9 I have made him fair by the multitud of hi branches: so that
al the tree of eden, that were in the garden of god, envi him.

31:10 therefor thu saith the lord god; becaus thou hast lift up
thyself in height, and he hath shot up hi top among the thick boughs,
and hi heart is lift up in hi height; 31:11 I have therefore
deliv him into the hand of the mighti one of the heathen; he shall
sur deal with him: I have driven him out for hi wickedness.

31:12 and strangers, the terribl of the nations, have cut him off,
and have left him: upon the mountain and in all the valley his
branch are fallen, and hi bough are broken by all the river of
th land; and all the peopl of the earth are gone down from his
shadow, and have left him.

31:13 upon hi ruin shall all the fowl of the heaven remain, and all
th beast of the field shall be upon hi branches: 31:14 To the end
that none of all the tree by the water exalt themselv for their
height, neither shoot up their top among the thick boughs, neither
their tree stand up in their height, all that drink water: for they
ar all deliv unto death, to the nether part of the earth, in the
midst of the children of men, with them that go down to the pit.

31:15 thu saith the lord god; In the day when he went down to the
grav I caus a mourning: I cover the deep for him, and i
restrain the flood thereof, and the great water were stayed: and i
caus lebanon to mourn for him, and all the tree of the field
faint for him.

31:16 I made the nation to shake at the sound of hi fall, when i
cast him down to hell with them that descend into the pit: and all the
tre of eden, the choic and best of lebanon, all that drink water,
shal be comfort in the nether part of the earth.

31:17 they also went down into hell with him unto them that be slain
with the sword; and they that were hi arm, that dwelt under his
shadow in the midst of the heathen.

31:18 To whom art thou thu like in glori and in great among the
tre of eden? yet shalt thou be brought down with the tree of eden
unto the nether part of the earth: thou shalt lie in the midst of the
uncircumcis with them that be slain by the sword. thi is pharaoh
and all hi multitude, saith the lord god.

32:1 and it came to pass in the twelfth year, in the twelfth month, in
th first day of the month, that the word of the lord came unto me,
saying, 32:2 son of man, take up a lament for pharaoh king of
egypt, and say unto him, thou art like a young lion of the nations,
and thou art as a whale in the seas: and thou camest forth with thy
rivers, and troubledst the water with thi feet, and fouledst their
rivers.

32:3 thu saith the lord god; I will therefor spread out my net over
the with a compani of mani people; and they shall bring thee up in my
net.

32:4 then will I leav thee upon the land, I will cast thee forth upon
th open field, and will caus all the fowl of the heaven to remain
upon thee, and I will fill the beast of the whole earth with thee.

32:5 and I will lay thi flesh upon the mountains, and fill the valleys
with thi height.

32:6 I will also water with thi blood the land wherein thou swimmest,
even to the mountains; and the river shall be full of thee.

32:7 and when I shall put thee out, I will cover the heaven, and make
th star thereof dark; I will cover the sun with a cloud, and the
moon shall not give her light.

32:8 all the bright light of heaven will I make dark over thee, and
set dark upon thi land, saith the lord god.

32:9 I will also vex the heart of mani people, when I shall bring thy
destruct among the nations, into the countri which thou hast not
known.

32:10 yea, I will make mani peopl amaz at thee, and their kings
shal be horribl afraid for thee, when I shall brandish my sword
befor them; and they shall trembl at everi moment, everi man for his
own life, in the day of thi fall.

32:11 for thu saith the lord god; the sword of the king of babylon
shal come upon thee.

32:12 By the sword of the mighti will I caus thi multitud to fall,
th terribl of the nations, all of them: and they shall spoil the
pomp of egypt, and all the multitud thereof shall be destroyed.

32:13 I will destroy also all the beast thereof from besid the great
waters; neither shall the foot of man troubl them ani more, nor the
hoof of beast troubl them.

32:14 then will I make their water deep, and caus their river to
run like oil, saith the lord god.

32:15 when I shall make the land of egypt desolate, and the country
shal be destitut of that whereof it wa full, when I shall smite all
them that dwell therein, then shall they know that I am the lord.

32:16 thi is the lament wherewith they shall lament her: the
daught of the nation shall lament her: they shall lament for her,
even for egypt, and for all her multitude, saith the lord god.

32:17 It came to pass also in the twelfth year, in the fifteenth day
of the month, that the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 32:18
son of man, wail for the multitud of egypt, and cast them down, even
her, and the daughter of the famou nations, unto the nether part of
th earth, with them that go down into the pit.

32:19 whom dost thou pass in beauty? go down, and be thou laid with
th uncircumcised.

32:20 they shall fall in the midst of them that are slain by the
sword: she is deliv to the sword: draw her and all her multitudes.

32:21 the strong among the mighti shall speak to him out of the midst
of hell with them that help him: they are gone down, they lie
uncircumcised, slain by the sword.

32:22 asshur is there and all her company: hi grave are about him:
al of them slain, fallen by the sword: 32:23 whose grave are set in
th side of the pit, and her compani is round about her grave: all of
them slain, fallen by the sword, which caus terror in the land of
th living.

32:24 there is elam and all her multitud round about her grave, all
of them slain, fallen by the sword, which are gone down uncircumcised
into the nether part of the earth, which caus their terror in the
land of the living; yet have they born their shame with them that go
down to the pit.

32:25 they have set her a bed in the midst of the slain with all her
multitude: her grave are round about him: all of them uncircumcised,
slain by the sword: though their terror wa caus in the land of the
living, yet have they born their shame with them that go down to the
pit: he is put in the midst of them that be slain.

32:26 there is meshech, tubal, and all her multitude: her grave are
round about him: all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword, though
they caus their terror in the land of the living.

32:27 and they shall not lie with the mighti that are fallen of the
uncircumcised, which are gone down to hell with their weapon of war:
and they have laid their sword under their heads, but their
iniqu shall be upon their bones, though they were the terror of
th mighti in the land of the living.

32:28 yea, thou shalt be broken in the midst of the uncircumcised, and
shalt lie with them that are slain with the sword.

32:29 there is edom, her kings, and all her princes, which with their
might are laid by them that were slain by the sword: they shall lie
with the uncircumcised, and with them that go down to the pit.

32:30 there be the princ of the north, all of them, and all the
zidonians, which are gone down with the slain; with their terror they
ar asham of their might; and they lie uncircumcis with them that
b slain by the sword, and bear their shame with them that go down to
th pit.

32:31 pharaoh shall see them, and shall be comfort over all his
multitude, even pharaoh and all hi armi slain by the sword, saith the
lord god.

32:32 for I have caus my terror in the land of the living: and he
shal be laid in the midst of the uncircumcis with them that are
slain with the sword, even pharaoh and all hi multitude, saith the
lord god.

33:1 again the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 33:2 son of man,
speak to the children of thi people, and say unto them, when I bring
th sword upon a land, if the peopl of the land take a man of their
coasts, and set him for their watchman: 33:3 If when he seeth the
sword come upon the land, he blow the trumpet, and warn the people;
33:4 then whosoev heareth the sound of the trumpet, and taketh not
warning; if the sword come, and take him away, hi blood shall be upon
hi own head.

33:5 He heard the sound of the trumpet, and took not warning; his
blood shall be upon him. but he that taketh warn shall deliv his
soul.

33:6 but if the watchman see the sword come, and blow not the trumpet,
and the peopl be not warned; if the sword come, and take ani person
from among them, he is taken away in hi iniquity; but hi blood will
i requir at the watchman' hand.

33:7 So thou, O son of man, I have set thee a watchman unto the house
of israel; therefor thou shalt hear the word at my mouth, and warn
them from me.

33:8 when I say unto the wicked, O wick man, thou shalt sure die;
if thou dost not speak to warn the wick from hi way, that wicked
man shall die in hi iniquity; but hi blood will I requir at thine
hand.

33:9 nevertheless, if thou warn the wick of hi way to turn from it;
if he do not turn from hi way, he shall die in hi iniquity; but thou
hast deliv thi soul.

33:10 therefore, O thou son of man, speak unto the hous of israel;
thu ye speak, saying, If our transgress and our sin be upon us,
and we pine away in them, how should we then live?  33:11 say unto
them, As I live, saith the lord god, I have no pleasur in the death
of the wicked; but that the wick turn from hi way and live: turn
ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for whi will ye die, O hous of
israel?  33:12 therefore, thou son of man, say unto the children of
thi people, the righteous of the righteou shall not deliv him
in the day of hi transgression: as for the wicked of the wicked,
h shall not fall therebi in the day that he turneth from his
wickedness; neither shall the righteou be abl to live for his
right in the day that he sinneth.

33:13 when I shall say to the righteous, that he shall sure live; if
h trust to hi own righteousness, and commit iniquity, all his
right shall not be remembered; but for hi iniqu that he
hath committed, he shall die for it.

33:14 again, when I say unto the wicked, thou shalt sure die; if he
turn from hi sin, and do that which is law and right; 33:15 If the
wick restor the pledge, give again that he had robbed, walk in the
statut of life, without commit iniquity; he shall sure live,
h shall not die.

33:16 none of hi sin that he hath commit shall be mention unto
him: he hath done that which is law and right; he shall surely
live.

33:17 yet the children of thi peopl say, the way of the lord is not
equal: but as for them, their way is not equal.

33:18 when the righteou turneth from hi righteousness, and
committeth iniquity, he shall even die thereby.

33:19 but if the wick turn from hi wickedness, and do that which is
law and right, he shall live thereby.

33:20 yet ye say, the way of the lord is not equal. O ye hous of
israel, I will judg you everi one after hi ways.

33:21 and it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the
tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped
out of jerusalem came unto me, saying, the citi is smitten.

33:22 now the hand of the lord wa upon me in the evening, afor he
that wa escap came; and had open my mouth, until he came to me in
th morning; and my mouth wa opened, and I wa no more dumb.

33:23 then the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 33:24 son of
man, they that inhabit those wast of the land of israel speak,
saying, abraham wa one, and he inherit the land: but we are many;
th land is given us for inheritance.

33:25 wherefor say unto them, thu saith the lord god; Ye eat with
th blood, and lift up your eye toward your idols, and shed blood:
and shall ye possess the land?  33:26 Ye stand upon your sword, ye
work abomination, and ye defil everi one hi neighbour' wife: and
shal ye possess the land?  33:27 say thou thu unto them, thu saith
th lord god; As I live, sure they that are in the wast shall fall
bi the sword, and him that is in the open field will I give to the
beast to be devoured, and they that be in the fort and in the caves
shal die of the pestilence.

33:28 for I will lay the land most desolate, and the pomp of her
strength shall cease; and the mountain of israel shall be desolate,
that none shall pass through.

33:29 then shall they know that I am the lord, when I have laid the
land most desol becaus of all their abomin which they have
committed.

33:30 also, thou son of man, the children of thi peopl still are
talk against thee by the wall and in the door of the houses, and
speak one to another, everi one to hi brother, saying, come, I pray
you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the lord.

33:31 and they come unto thee as the peopl cometh, and they sit
befor thee as my people, and they hear thi words, but they will not
do them: for with their mouth they shew much love, but their heart
goeth after their covetousness.

33:32 and, lo, thou art unto them as a veri love song of one that
hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument: for they
hear thi words, but they do them not.

33:33 and when thi cometh to pass, (lo, it will come,) then shall
they know that a prophet hath been among them.

34:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 34:2 son of man,
prophesi against the shepherd of israel, prophesy, and say unto them,
thu saith the lord god unto the shepherds; woe be to the shepherd of
israel that do feed themselves! should not the shepherd feed the
flocks?  34:3 Ye eat the fat, and ye cloth you with the wool, ye kill
them that are fed: but ye feed not the flock.

34:4 the diseas have ye not strengthened, neither have ye healed
that which wa sick, neither have ye bound up that which wa broken,
neith have ye brought again that which wa driven away, neither have
y sought that which wa lost; but with forc and with cruelti have ye
rul them.

34:5 and they were scattered, becaus there is no shepherd: and they
becam meat to all the beast of the field, when they were scattered.

34:6 My sheep wander through all the mountains, and upon everi high
hill: yea, my flock wa scatter upon all the face of the earth, and
non did search or seek after them.

34:7 therefore, ye shepherds, hear the word of the lord; 34:8 As i
live, saith the lord god, sure becaus my flock becam a prey, and
mi flock becam meat to everi beast of the field, becaus there wa no
shepherd, neither did my shepherd search for my flock, but the
shepherd fed themselves, and fed not my flock; 34:9 therefore, O ye
shepherds, hear the word of the lord; 34:10 thu saith the lord god;
behold, I am against the shepherds; and I will requir my flock at
their hand, and caus them to ceas from feed the flock; neither
shal the shepherd feed themselv ani more; for I will deliv my
flock from their mouth, that they may not be meat for them.

34:11 for thu saith the lord god; behold, I, even I, will both search
mi sheep, and seek them out.

34:12 As a shepherd seeketh out hi flock in the day that he is among
hi sheep that are scattered; so will I seek out my sheep, and will
deliv them out of all place where they have been scatter in the
cloudi and dark day.

34:13 and I will bring them out from the people, and gather them from
th countries, and will bring them to their own land, and feed them
upon the mountain of israel by the rivers, and in all the inhabited
plac of the country.

34:14 I will feed them in a good pasture, and upon the high mountains
of israel shall their fold be: there shall they lie in a good fold,
and in a fat pastur shall they feed upon the mountain of israel.

34:15 I will feed my flock, and I will caus them to lie down, saith
th lord god.

34:16 I will seek that which wa lost, and bring again that which was
driven away, and will bind up that which wa broken, and will
strengthen that which wa sick: but I will destroy the fat and the
strong; I will feed them with judgment.

34:17 and as for you, O my flock, thu saith the lord god; behold, i
judg between cattl and cattle, between the ram and the he goats.

34:18 seemeth it a small thing unto you to have eaten up the good
pasture, but ye must tread down with your feet the residu of your
pastures? and to have drunk of the deep waters, but ye must foul the
residu with your feet?  34:19 and as for my flock, they eat that
which ye have trodden with your feet; and they drink that which ye
hav foul with your feet.

34:20 therefor thu saith the lord god unto them; behold, I, even i,
wil judg between the fat cattl and between the lean cattle.

34:21 becaus ye have thrust with side and with shoulder, and pushed
al the diseas with your horns, till ye have scatter them abroad;
34:22 therefor will I save my flock, and they shall no more be a
prey; and I will judg between cattl and cattle.

34:23 and I will set up one shepherd over them, and he shall feed
them, even my servant david; he shall feed them, and he shall be their
shepherd.

34:24 and I the lord will be their god, and my servant david a prince
among them; I the lord have spoken it.

34:25 and I will make with them a coven of peace, and will cause
th evil beast to ceas out of the land: and they shall dwell safely
in the wilderness, and sleep in the woods.

34:26 and I will make them and the place round about my hill a
blessing; and I will caus the shower to come down in hi season;
ther shall be shower of blessing.

34:27 and the tree of the field shall yield her fruit, and the earth
shal yield her increase, and they shall be safe in their land, and
shal know that I am the lord, when I have broken the band of their
yoke, and deliv them out of the hand of those that served
themselv of them.

34:28 and they shall no more be a prey to the heathen, neither shall
th beast of the land devour them; but they shall dwell safely, and
non shall make them afraid.

34:29 and I will rais up for them a plant of renown, and they shall
b no more consum with hunger in the land, neither bear the shame of
th heathen ani more.

34:30 thu shall they know that I the lord their god am with them, and
that they, even the hous of israel, are my people, saith the lord
god.

34:31 and ye my flock, the flock of my pasture, are men, and I am your
god, saith the lord god.

35:1 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 35:2 son of
man, set thi face against mount seir, and prophesi against it, 35:3
and say unto it, thu saith the lord god; behold, O mount seir, I am
against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and i
wil make thee most desolate.

35:4 I will lay thi citi waste, and thou shalt be desolate, and thou
shalt know that I am the lord.

35:5 becaus thou hast had a perpetu hatred, and hast shed the blood
of the children of israel by the forc of the sword in the time of
their calamity, in the time that their iniqu had an end: 35:6
therefore, as I live, saith the lord god, I will prepar thee unto
blood, and blood shall pursu thee: sith thou hast not hate blood,
even blood shall pursu thee.

35:7 thu will I make mount seir most desolate, and cut off from it
him that passeth out and him that returneth.

35:8 and I will fill hi mountain with hi slain men: in thi hills,
and in thi valleys, and in all thi rivers, shall they fall that are
slain with the sword.

35:9 I will make thee perpetu desolations, and thi citi shall not
return: and ye shall know that I am the lord.

35:10 becaus thou hast said, these two nation and these two
countri shall be mine, and we will possess it; wherea the lord was
there: 35:11 therefore, as I live, saith the lord god, I will even do
accord to thine anger, and accord to thine envi which thou hast
us out of thi hatr against them; and I will make myself known
among them, when I have judg thee.

35:12 and thou shalt know that I am the lord, and that I have heard
al thi blasphemi which thou hast spoken against the mountain of
israel, saying, they are laid desolate, they are given us to consume.

35:13 thu with your mouth ye have boast against me, and have
multipli your word against me: I have heard them.

35:14 thu saith the lord god; when the whole earth rejoiceth, I will
mak thee desolate.

35:15 As thou didst rejoic at the inherit of the hous of israel,
becaus it wa desolate, so will I do unto thee: thou shalt be
desolate, O mount seir, and all idumea, even all of it: and they shall
know that I am the lord.

36:1 also, thou son of man, prophesi unto the mountain of israel, and
say, Ye mountain of israel, hear the word of the lord: 36:2 thus
saith the lord god; becaus the enemi hath said against you, aha, even
th ancient high place are our in possession: 36:3 therefore
prophesi and say, thu saith the lord god; becaus they have made you
desolate, and swallow you up on everi side, that ye might be a
possess unto the residu of the heathen, and ye are taken up in the
lip of talkers, and are an infami of the people: 36:4 therefore, ye
mountain of israel, hear the word of the lord god; thu saith the
lord god to the mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the
valleys, to the desol wastes, and to the citi that are forsaken,
which becam a prey and deris to the residu of the heathen that
ar round about; 36:5 therefor thu saith the lord god; sure in the
fir of my jealousi have I spoken against the residu of the heathen,
and against all idumea, which have appoint my land into their
possess with the joy of all their heart, with despit minds, to
cast it out for a prey.

36:6 prophesi therefor concern the land of israel, and say unto
th mountains, and to the hills, to the rivers, and to the valleys,
thu saith the lord god; behold, I have spoken in my jealousi and in
mi fury, becaus ye have born the shame of the heathen: 36:7
therefor thu saith the lord god; I have lift up mine hand, surely
th heathen that are about you, they shall bear their shame.

36:8 but ye, O mountain of israel, ye shall shoot forth your
branches, and yield your fruit to my peopl of israel; for they are at
hand to come.

36:9 for, behold, I am for you, and I will turn unto you, and ye shall
b till and sown: 36:10 and I will multipli men upon you, all the
hous of israel, even all of it: and the citi shall be inhabited,
and the wast shall be builded: 36:11 and I will multipli upon you
man and beast; and they shall increas and bring fruit: and I will
settl you after your old estates, and will do better unto you than at
your beginnings: and ye shall know that I am the lord.

36:12 yea, I will caus men to walk upon you, even my peopl israel;
and they shall possess thee, and thou shalt be their inheritance, and
thou shalt no more henceforth bereav them of men.

36:13 thu saith the lord god; becaus they say unto you, thou land
devourest up men, and hast bereav thi nations: 36:14 therefor thou
shalt devour men no more, neither bereav thi nation ani more, saith
th lord god.

36:15 neither will I caus men to hear in thee the shame of the
heathen ani more, neither shalt thou bear the reproach of the people
ani more, neither shalt thou caus thi nation to fall ani more, saith
th lord god.

36:16 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 36:17 son of
man, when the hous of israel dwelt in their own land, they defil it
bi their own way and by their doings: their way wa befor me as the
unclean of a remov woman.

36:18 wherefor I pour my furi upon them for the blood that they had
sh upon the land, and for their idol wherewith they had polluted
it: 36:19 and I scatter them among the heathen, and they were
dispers through the countries: accord to their way and according
to their do I judg them.

36:20 and when they enter unto the heathen, whither they went, they
profan my holi name, when they said to them, these are the peopl of
th lord, and are gone forth out of hi land.

36:21 but I had piti for mine holi name, which the hous of israel had
profan among the heathen, whither they went.

36:22 therefor say unto the hous of israel, thu saith the lord god;
i do not thi for your sakes, O hous of israel, but for mine holy
name' sake, which ye have profan among the heathen, whither ye
went.

36:23 and I will sanctifi my great name, which wa profan among the
heathen, which ye have profan in the midst of them; and the heathen
shal know that I am the lord, saith the lord god, when I shall be
sanctifi in you befor their eyes.

36:24 for I will take you from among the heathen, and gather you out
of all countries, and will bring you into your own land.

36:25 then will I sprinkl clean water upon you, and ye shall be
clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will i
cleans you.

36:26 A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put
within you: and I will take away the stoni heart out of your flesh,
and I will give you an heart of flesh.

36:27 and I will put my spirit within you, and caus you to walk in my
statutes, and ye shall keep my judgments, and do them.

36:28 and ye shall dwell in the land that I gave to your fathers; and
y shall be my people, and I will be your god.

36:29 I will also save you from all your uncleannesses: and I will
cal for the corn, and will increas it, and lay no famin upon you.

36:30 and I will multipli the fruit of the tree, and the increas of
th field, that ye shall receiv no more reproach of famin among the
heathen.

36:31 then shall ye rememb your own evil ways, and your do that
wer not good, and shall loth yourselv in your own sight for your
iniqu and for your abominations.

36:32 not for your sake do I this, saith the lord god, be it known
unto you: be asham and confound for your own ways, O hous of
israel.

36:33 thu saith the lord god; In the day that I shall have cleansed
y from all your iniqu I will also caus you to dwell in the
cities, and the wast shall be builded.

36:34 and the desol land shall be tilled, wherea it lay desolate
in the sight of all that pass by.

36:35 and they shall say, thi land that wa desol is becom like
th garden of eden; and the wast and desol and ruin citi are
becom fenced, and are inhabited.

36:36 then the heathen that are left round about you shall know that i
th lord build the ruin places, and plant that that wa desolate: i
th lord have spoken it, and I will do it.

36:37 thu saith the lord god; I will yet for thi be enquir of by
th hous of israel, to do it for them; I will increas them with men
lik a flock.

36:38 As the holi flock, as the flock of jerusalem in her solemn
feasts; so shall the wast citi be fill with flock of men: and
they shall know that I am the lord.

37:1 the hand of the lord wa upon me, and carri me out in the
spirit of the lord, and set me down in the midst of the valley which
wa full of bones, 37:2 and caus me to pass by them round about:
and, behold, there were veri mani in the open valley; and, lo, they
wer veri dry.

37:3 and he said unto me, son of man, can these bone live? and i
answered, O lord god, thou knowest.

37:4 again he said unto me, prophesi upon these bones, and say unto
them, O ye dri bones, hear the word of the lord.

37:5 thu saith the lord god unto these bones; behold, I will cause
breath to enter into you, and ye shall live: 37:6 and I will lay
sinew upon you, and will bring up flesh upon you, and cover you with
skin, and put breath in you, and ye shall live; and ye shall know that
i am the lord.

37:7 So I prophesi as I wa commanded: and as I prophesied, there
wa a noise, and behold a shaking, and the bone came together, bone
to hi bone.

37:8 and when I beheld, lo, the sinew and the flesh came up upon
them, and the skin cover them above: but there wa no breath in
them.

37:9 then said he unto me, prophesi unto the wind, prophesy, son of
man, and say to the wind, thu saith the lord god; come from the four
winds, O breath, and breath upon these slain, that they may live.

37:10 So I prophesi as he command me, and the breath came into
them, and they lived, and stood up upon their feet, an exceed great
army.

37:11 then he said unto me, son of man, these bone are the whole
hous of israel: behold, they say, our bone are dried, and our hope
i lost: we are cut off for our parts.

37:12 therefor prophesi and say unto them, thu saith the lord god;
behold, O my people, I will open your graves, and caus you to come up
out of your graves, and bring you into the land of israel.

37:13 and ye shall know that I am the lord, when I have open your
graves, O my people, and brought you up out of your graves, 37:14 and
shal put my spirit in you, and ye shall live, and I shall place you
in your own land: then shall ye know that I the lord have spoken it,
and perform it, saith the lord.

37:15 the word of the lord came again unto me, saying, 37:16 moreover,
th son of man, take thee one stick, and write upon it, for judah,
and for the children of israel hi companions: then take another
stick, and write upon it, for joseph, the stick of ephraim and for all
th hous of israel hi companions: 37:17 and join them one to another
into one stick; and they shall becom one in thine hand.

37:18 and when the children of thi peopl shall speak unto thee,
saying, wilt thou not shew us what thou meanest by these?  37:19 say
unto them, thu saith the lord god; behold, I will take the stick of
joseph, which is in the hand of ephraim, and the tribe of israel his
fellows, and will put them with him, even with the stick of judah, and
mak them one stick, and they shall be one in mine hand.

37:20 and the stick whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand
befor their eyes.

37:21 and say unto them, thu saith the lord god; behold, I will take
th children of israel from among the heathen, whither they be gone,
and will gather them on everi side, and bring them into their own
land: 37:22 and I will make them one nation in the land upon the
mountain of israel; and one king shall be king to them all: and they
shal be no more two nations, neither shall they be divid into two
kingdom ani more at all.

37:23 neither shall they defil themselv ani more with their idols,
nor with their detest things, nor with ani of their
transgressions: but I will save them out of all their dwellingplaces,
wherein they have sinned, and will cleans them: so shall they be my
people, and I will be their god.

37:24 and david my servant shall be king over them; and they all shall
hav one shepherd: they shall also walk in my judgments, and observe
mi statutes, and do them.

37:25 and they shall dwell in the land that I have given unto jacob my
servant, wherein your father have dwelt; and they shall dwell
therein, even they, and their children, and their children' children
for ever: and my servant david shall be their princ for ever.

37:26 moreov I will make a coven of peac with them; it shall be
an everlast coven with them: and I will place them, and multiply
them, and will set my sanctuari in the midst of them for evermore.

37:27 My tabernacl also shall be with them: yea, I will be their god,
and they shall be my people.

37:28 and the heathen shall know that I the lord do sanctifi israel,
when my sanctuari shall be in the midst of them for evermore.

38:1 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 38:2 son of man,
set thi face against gog, the land of magog, the chief princ of
meshech and tubal, and prophesi against him, 38:3 and say, thu saith
th lord god; behold, I am against thee, O gog, the chief princ of
meshech and tubal: 38:4 and I will turn thee back, and put hook into
thi jaws, and I will bring thee forth, and all thine army, hors and
horsemen, all of them cloth with all sort of armour, even a great
compani with buckler and shields, all of them handl swords: 38:5
persia, ethiopia, and libya with them; all of them with shield and
helmet: 38:6 gomer, and all hi bands; the hous of togarmah of the
north quarters, and all hi bands: and mani peopl with thee.

38:7 Be thou prepared, and prepar for thyself, thou, and all thy
compani that are assembl unto thee, and be thou a guard unto them.

38:8 after mani day thou shalt be visited: in the latter year thou
shalt come into the land that is brought back from the sword, and is
gath out of mani people, against the mountain of israel, which
hav been alway waste: but it is brought forth out of the nations,
and they shall dwell safe all of them.

38:9 thou shalt ascend and come like a storm, thou shalt be like a
cloud to cover the land, thou, and all thi bands, and mani peopl with
thee.

38:10 thu saith the lord god; It shall also come to pass, that at the
sam time shall thing come into thi mind, and thou shalt think an
evil thought: 38:11 and thou shalt say, I will go up to the land of
unwal villages; I will go to them that are at rest, that dwell
safely, all of them dwell without walls, and have neither bars
nor gates, 38:12 To take a spoil, and to take a prey; to turn thine
hand upon the desol place that are now inhabited, and upon the
peopl that are gather out of the nations, which have gotten cattle
and goods, that dwell in the midst of the land.

38:13 sheba, and dedan, and the merchant of tarshish, with all the
young lion thereof, shall say unto thee, art thou come to take a
spoil? hast thou gather thi compani to take a prey? to carri away
silv and gold, to take away cattl and goods, to take a great spoil?
38:14 therefore, son of man, prophesi and say unto gog, thu saith the
lord god; In that day when my peopl of israel dwelleth safely, shalt
thou not know it?  38:15 and thou shalt come from thi place out of the
north parts, thou, and mani peopl with thee, all of them ride upon
horses, a great company, and a mighti army: 38:16 and thou shalt come
up against my peopl of israel, as a cloud to cover the land; it shall
b in the latter days, and I will bring thee against my land, that the
heathen may know me, when I shall be sanctifi in thee, O gog, before
their eyes.

38:17 thu saith the lord god; art thou he of whom I have spoken in
old time by my servant the prophet of israel, which prophesi in
thos day mani year that I would bring thee against them?  38:18 and
it shall come to pass at the same time when gog shall come against the
land of israel, saith the lord god, that my furi shall come up in my
face.

38:19 for in my jealousi and in the fire of my wrath have I spoken,
sur in that day there shall be a great shake in the land of
israel; 38:20 So that the fish of the sea, and the fowl of the
heaven, and the beast of the field, and all creep thing that
creep upon the earth, and all the men that are upon the face of the
earth, shall shake at my presence, and the mountain shall be thrown
down, and the steep place shall fall, and everi wall shall fall to
th ground.

38:21 and I will call for a sword against him throughout all my
mountains, saith the lord god: everi man' sword shall be against his
brother.

38:22 and I will plead against him with pestil and with blood; and
i will rain upon him, and upon hi bands, and upon the mani people
that are with him, an overflow rain, and great hailstones, fire,
and brimstone.

38:23 thu will I magnifi myself, and sanctifi myself; and I will be
known in the eye of mani nations, and they shall know that I am the
lord.
