39:1 therefore, thou son of man, prophesi against gog, and say, thus
saith the lord god; behold, I am against thee, O gog, the chief prince
of meshech and tubal: 39:2 and I will turn thee back, and leav but
th sixth part of thee, and will caus thee to come up from the north
parts, and will bring thee upon the mountain of israel: 39:3 and i
wil smite thi bow out of thi left hand, and will caus thine arrows
to fall out of thi right hand.

39:4 thou shalt fall upon the mountain of israel, thou, and all thy
bands, and the peopl that is with thee: I will give thee unto the
raven bird of everi sort, and to the beast of the field to be
devoured.

39:5 thou shalt fall upon the open field: for I have spoken it, saith
th lord god.

39:6 and I will send a fire on magog, and among them that dwell
carelessli in the isles: and they shall know that I am the lord.

39:7 So will I make my holi name known in the midst of my people
israel; and I will not let them pollut my holi name ani more: and the
heathen shall know that I am the lord, the holi one in israel.

39:8 behold, it is come, and it is done, saith the lord god; thi is
th day whereof I have spoken.

39:9 and they that dwell in the citi of israel shall go forth, and
shal set on fire and burn the weapons, both the shield and the
bucklers, the bow and the arrows, and the handstaves, and the spears,
and they shall burn them with fire seven years: 39:10 So that they
shal take no wood out of the field, neither cut down ani out of the
forests; for they shall burn the weapon with fire: and they shall
spoil those that spoil them, and rob those that rob them, saith
th lord god.

39:11 and it shall come to pass in that day, that I will give unto gog
a place there of grave in israel, the valley of the passeng on the
east of the sea: and it shall stop the nose of the passengers: and
ther shall they buri gog and all hi multitude: and they shall call
it the valley of hamongog.

39:12 and seven month shall the hous of israel be buri of them,
that they may cleans the land.

39:13 yea, all the peopl of the land shall buri them; and it shall be
to them a renown the day that I shall be glorified, saith the lord
god.

39:14 and they shall sever out men of continu employment, passing
through the land to buri with the passeng those that remain upon
th face of the earth, to cleans it: after the end of seven months
shal they search.

39:15 and the passeng that pass through the land, when ani seeth a
man' bone, then shall he set up a sign by it, till the burier have
buri it in the valley of hamongog.

39:16 and also the name of the citi shall be hamonah. thu shall they
cleans the land.

39:17 and, thou son of man, thu saith the lord god; speak unto every
feath fowl, and to everi beast of the field, assembl yourselves,
and come; gather yourselv on everi side to my sacrific that I do
sacrific for you, even a great sacrific upon the mountain of
israel, that ye may eat flesh, and drink blood.

39:18 Ye shall eat the flesh of the mighty, and drink the blood of the
princ of the earth, of rams, of lambs, and of goats, of bullocks,
al of them fatl of bashan.

39:19 and ye shall eat fat till ye be full, and drink blood till ye be
drunken, of my sacrific which I have sacrif for you.

39:20 thu ye shall be fill at my tabl with hors and chariots,
with mighti men, and with all men of war, saith the lord god.

39:21 and I will set my glori among the heathen, and all the heathen
shal see my judgment that I have executed, and my hand that I have
laid upon them.

39:22 So the hous of israel shall know that I am the lord their god
from that day and forward.

39:23 and the heathen shall know that the hous of israel went into
capt for their iniquity: becaus they trespass against me,
therefor hid I my face from them, and gave them into the hand of
their enemies: so fell they all by the sword.

39:24 accord to their unclean and accord to their
transgress have I done unto them, and hid my face from them.

39:25 therefor thu saith the lord god; now will I bring again the
capt of jacob, and have merci upon the whole hous of israel, and
wil be jealou for my holi name; 39:26 after that they have borne
their shame, and all their trespass wherebi they have trespassed
against me, when they dwelt safe in their land, and none made them
afraid.

39:27 when I have brought them again from the people, and gathered
them out of their enemies' lands, and am sanctifi in them in the
sight of mani nations; 39:28 then shall they know that I am the lord
their god, which caus them to be led into captiv among the
heathen: but I have gather them unto their own land, and have left
non of them ani more there.

39:29 neither will I hide my face ani more from them: for I have
pour out my spirit upon the hous of israel, saith the lord god.

40:1 In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning
of the year, in the tenth day of the month, in the fourteenth year
aft that the citi wa smitten, in the selfsam day the hand of the
lord wa upon me, and brought me thither.

40:2 In the vision of god brought he me into the land of israel, and
set me upon a veri high mountain, by which wa as the frame of a city
on the south.

40:3 and he brought me thither, and, behold, there wa a man, whose
appear wa like the appear of brass, with a line of flax in
hi hand, and a measur reed; and he stood in the gate.

40:4 and the man said unto me, son of man, behold with thine eyes, and
hear with thine ears, and set thine heart upon all that I shall shew
thee; for to the intent that I might shew them unto thee art thou
brought hither: declar all that thou seest to the hous of israel.

40:5 and behold a wall on the outsid of the hous round about, and in
th man' hand a measur reed of six cubit long by the cubit and an
hand breadth: so he measur the breadth of the building, one reed;
and the height, one reed.

40:6 then came he unto the gate which looketh toward the east, and
went up the stair thereof, and measur the threshold of the gate,
which wa one reed broad; and the other threshold of the gate, which
wa one reed broad.

40:7 and everi littl chamber wa one reed long, and one reed broad;
and between the littl chamber were five cubits; and the threshold of
th gate by the porch of the gate within wa one reed.

40:8 He measur also the porch of the gate within, one reed.

40:9 then measur he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the
post thereof, two cubits; and the porch of the gate wa inward.

40:10 and the littl chamber of the gate eastward were three on this
side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the
post had one measur on thi side and on that side.

40:11 and he measur the breadth of the entri of the gate, ten
cubits; and the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

40:12 the space also befor the littl chamber wa one cubit on this
side, and the space wa one cubit on that side: and the little
chamb were six cubit on thi side, and six cubit on that side.

40:13 He measur then the gate from the roof of one littl chamber to
th roof of another: the breadth wa five and twenti cubits, door
against door.

40:14 He made also post of threescor cubits, even unto the post of
th court round about the gate.

40:15 and from the face of the gate of the entranc unto the face of
th porch of the inner gate were fifti cubits.

40:16 and there were narrow window to the littl chambers, and to
their post within the gate round about, and likewis to the arches:
and window were round about inward: and upon each post were palm
trees.

40:17 then brought he me into the outward court, and, lo, there were
chambers, and a pavement made for the court round about: thirty
chamb were upon the pavement.

40:18 and the pavement by the side of the gate over against the
length of the gate wa the lower pavement.

40:19 then he measur the breadth from the forefront of the lower
g unto the forefront of the inner court without, an hundr cubits
eastward and northward.

40:20 and the gate of the outward court that look toward the north,
h measur the length thereof, and the breadth thereof.

40:21 and the littl chamber thereof were three on thi side and
thre on that side; and the post thereof and the arch thereof were
aft the measur of the first gate: the length thereof wa fifty
cubits, and the breadth five and twenti cubits.

40:22 and their windows, and their arches, and their palm trees, were
aft the measur of the gate that looketh toward the east; and they
went up unto it by seven steps; and the arch thereof were before
them.

40:23 and the gate of the inner court wa over against the gate toward
th north, and toward the east; and he measur from gate to gate an
hundr cubits.

40:24 after that he brought me toward the south, and behold a gate
toward the south: and he measur the post thereof and the arches
thereof accord to these measures.

40:25 and there were window in it and in the arch thereof round
about, like those windows: the length wa fifti cubits, and the
breadth five and twenti cubits.

40:26 and there were seven step to go up to it, and the arches
thereof were befor them: and it had palm trees, one on thi side, and
anoth on that side, upon the post thereof.

40:27 and there wa a gate in the inner court toward the south: and he
measur from gate to gate toward the south an hundr cubits.

40:28 and he brought me to the inner court by the south gate: and he
measur the south gate accord to these measures; 40:29 and the
littl chamber thereof, and the post thereof, and the arches
thereof, accord to these measures: and there were window in it and
in the arch thereof round about: it wa fifti cubit long, and five
and twenti cubit broad.

40:30 and the arch round about were five and twenti cubit long, and
fiv cubit broad.

40:31 and the arch thereof were toward the utter court; and palm
tre were upon the post thereof: and the go up to it had eight
steps.

40:32 and he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he
measur the gate accord to these measures.

40:33 and the littl chamber thereof, and the post thereof, and the
arch thereof, were accord to these measures: and there were
window therein and in the arch thereof round about: it wa fifty
cubit long, and five and twenti cubit broad.

40:34 and the arch thereof were toward the outward court; and palm
tre were upon the post thereof, on thi side, and on that side: and
th go up to it had eight steps.

40:35 and he brought me to the north gate, and measur it according
to these measures; 40:36 the littl chamber thereof, the posts
thereof, and the arch thereof, and the window to it round about:
th length wa fifti cubits, and the breadth five and twenti cubits.

40:37 and the post thereof were toward the utter court; and palm
tre were upon the post thereof, on thi side, and on that side: and
th go up to it had eight steps.

40:38 and the chamber and the entri thereof were by the post of
th gates, where they wash the burnt offering.

40:39 and in the porch of the gate were two tabl on thi side, and
two tabl on that side, to slay thereon the burnt offer and the
sin offer and the trespass offering.

40:40 and at the side without, as one goeth up to the entri of the
north gate, were two tables; and on the other side, which wa at the
porch of the gate, were two tables.

40:41 four tabl were on thi side, and four tabl on that side, by
th side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew their
sacrifices.

40:42 and the four tabl were of hewn stone for the burnt offering,
of a cubit and an half long, and a cubit and an half broad, and one
cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instrument wherewith they
slew the burnt offer and the sacrifice.

40:43 and within were hooks, an hand broad, fasten round about: and
upon the tabl wa the flesh of the offering.

40:44 and without the inner gate were the chamber of the singer in
th inner court, which wa at the side of the north gate; and their
prospect wa toward the south: one at the side of the east gate having
th prospect toward the north.

40:45 and he said unto me, thi chamber, whose prospect is toward the
south, is for the priests, the keeper of the charg of the house.

40:46 and the chamber whose prospect is toward the north is for the
priests, the keeper of the charg of the altar: these are the son of
zadok among the son of levi, which come near to the lord to minister
unto him.

40:47 So he measur the court, an hundr cubit long, and an hundred
cubit broad, foursquare; and the altar that wa befor the house.

40:48 and he brought me to the porch of the house, and measur each
post of the porch, five cubit on thi side, and five cubit on that
side: and the breadth of the gate wa three cubit on thi side, and
thre cubit on that side.

40:49 the length of the porch wa twenti cubits, and the breadth
eleven cubits, and he brought me by the step wherebi they went up to
it: and there were pillar by the posts, one on thi side, and another
on that side.

41:1 afterward he brought me to the temple, and measur the posts,
six cubit broad on the one side, and six cubit broad on the other
side, which wa the breadth of the tabernacle.

41:2 and the breadth of the door wa ten cubits; and the side of the
door were five cubit on the one side, and five cubit on the other
side: and he measur the length thereof, forti cubits: and the
breadth, twenti cubits.

41:3 then went he inward, and measur the post of the door, two
cubits; and the door, six cubits; and the breadth of the door, seven
cubits.

41:4 So he measur the length thereof, twenti cubits; and the
breadth, twenti cubits, befor the temple: and he said unto me, this
i the most holi place.

41:5 after he measur the wall of the house, six cubits; and the
breadth of everi side chamber, four cubits, round about the hous on
everi side.

41:6 and the side chamber were three, one over another, and thirti in
order; and they enter into the wall which wa of the hous for the
sid chamber round about, that they might have hold, but they had not
hold in the wall of the house.

41:7 and there wa an enlarging, and a wind about still upward to
th side chambers: for the wind about of the hous went still
upward round about the house: therefor the breadth of the hous was
stil upward, and so increas from the lowest chamber to the highest
bi the midst.

41:8 I saw also the height of the hous round about: the foundations
of the side chamber were a full reed of six great cubits.

41:9 the thick of the wall, which wa for the side chamber
without, wa five cubits: and that which wa left wa the place of the
sid chamber that were within.

41:10 and between the chamber wa the wide of twenti cubit round
about the hous on everi side.

41:11 and the door of the side chamber were toward the place that
wa left, one door toward the north, and anoth door toward the
south: and the breadth of the place that wa left wa five cubits
round about.

41:12 now the build that wa befor the separ place at the end
toward the west wa seventi cubit broad; and the wall of the building
wa five cubit thick round about, and the length thereof ninety
cubits.

41:13 So he measur the house, an hundr cubit long; and the
separ place, and the building, with the wall thereof, an hundred
cubit long; 41:14 also the breadth of the face of the house, and of
th separ place toward the east, an hundr cubits.

41:15 and he measur the length of the build over against the
separ place which wa behind it, and the galleri thereof on the
on side and on the other side, an hundr cubits, with the inner
temple, and the porch of the court; 41:16 the door posts, and the
narrow windows, and the galleri round about on their three stories,
ov against the door, ciel with wood round about, and from the
ground up to the windows, and the window were covered; 41:17 To that
abov the door, even unto the inner house, and without, and by all the
wal round about within and without, by measure.

41:18 and it wa made with cherubim and palm trees, so that a palm
tre wa between a cherub and a cherub; and everi cherub had two
faces; 41:19 So that the face of a man wa toward the palm tree on the
on side, and the face of a young lion toward the palm tree on the
oth side: it wa made through all the hous round about.

41:20 from the ground unto abov the door were cherubim and palm
tre made, and on the wall of the temple.

41:21 the post of the templ were squared, and the face of the
sanctuary; the appear of the one as the appear of the other.

41:22 the altar of wood wa three cubit high, and the length thereof
two cubits; and the corner thereof, and the length thereof, and the
wal thereof, were of wood: and he said unto me, thi is the table
that is befor the lord.

41:23 and the templ and the sanctuari had two doors.

41:24 and the door had two leav apiece, two turn leaves; two
leav for the one door, and two leav for the other door.

41:25 and there were made on them, on the door of the temple,
cherubim and palm trees, like as were made upon the walls; and there
wer thick plank upon the face of the porch without.

41:26 and there were narrow window and palm tree on the one side and
on the other side, on the side of the porch, and upon the side
chamb of the house, and thick planks.

42:1 then he brought me forth into the utter court, the way toward the
north: and he brought me into the chamber that wa over against the
separ place, and which wa befor the build toward the north.

42:2 befor the length of an hundr cubit wa the north door, and
th breadth wa fifti cubits.

42:3 over against the twenti cubit which were for the inner court,
and over against the pavement which wa for the utter court, was
galleri against galleri in three stories.

42:4 and befor the chamber wa a walk to ten cubit breadth inward,
a way of one cubit; and their door toward the north.

42:5 now the upper chamber were shorter: for the galleri were
high than these, than the lower, and than the middlemost of the
building.

42:6 for they were in three stories, but had not pillar as the
pillar of the courts: therefor the build wa straiten more than
th lowest and the middlemost from the ground.

42:7 and the wall that wa without over against the chambers, toward
th utter court on the forepart of the chambers, the length thereof
wa fifti cubits.

42:8 for the length of the chamber that were in the utter court was
fifti cubits: and, lo, befor the templ were an hundr cubits.

42:9 and from under these chamber wa the entri on the east side, as
on goeth into them from the utter court.

42:10 the chamber were in the thick of the wall of the court
toward the east, over against the separ place, and over against the
building.

42:11 and the way befor them wa like the appear of the chambers
which were toward the north, as long as they, and as broad as they:
and all their go out were both accord to their fashions, and
accord to their doors.

42:12 and accord to the door of the chamber that were toward the
south wa a door in the head of the way, even the way directli before
th wall toward the east, as one entereth into them.

42:13 then said he unto me, the north chamber and the south chambers,
which are befor the separ place, they be holi chambers, where the
priest that approach unto the lord shall eat the most holi things:
ther shall they lay the most holi things, and the meat offering, and
th sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.

42:14 when the priest enter therein, then shall they not go out of
th holi place into the utter court, but there they shall lay their
gar wherein they minister; for they are holy; and shall put on
oth garments, and shall approach to those thing which are for the
people.

42:15 now when he had made an end of measur the inner house, he
brought me forth toward the gate whose prospect is toward the east,
and measur it round about.

42:16 He measur the east side with the measur reed, five hundred
reeds, with the measur reed round about.

42:17 He measur the north side, five hundr reeds, with the
measur reed round about.

42:18 He measur the south side, five hundr reeds, with the
measur reed.

42:19 He turn about to the west side, and measur five hundred
re with the measur reed.

42:20 He measur it by the four sides: it had a wall round about,
f hundr reed long, and five hundr broad, to make a separation
between the sanctuari and the profan place.

43:1 afterward he brought me to the gate, even the gate that looketh
toward the east: 43:2 and, behold, the glori of the god of israel came
from the way of the east: and hi voic wa like a nois of many
waters: and the earth shine with hi glory.

43:3 and it wa accord to the appear of the vision which I saw,
even accord to the vision that I saw when I came to destroy the
city: and the vision were like the vision that I saw by the river
chebar; and I fell upon my face.

43:4 and the glori of the lord came into the hous by the way of the
gat whose prospect is toward the east.

43:5 So the spirit took me up, and brought me into the inner court;
and, behold, the glori of the lord fill the house.

43:6 and I heard him speak unto me out of the house; and the man
stood by me.

43:7 and he said unto me, son of man, the place of my throne, and the
plac of the sole of my feet, where I will dwell in the midst of the
children of israel for ever, and my holi name, shall the hous of
israel no more defile, neither they, nor their kings, by their
whoredom, nor by the carcas of their king in their high places.

43:8 In their set of their threshold by my thresholds, and their
post by my posts, and the wall between me and them, they have even
defil my holi name by their abomin that they have committed:
wherefor I have consum them in mine anger.

43:9 now let them put away their whoredom, and the carcas of their
kings, far from me, and I will dwell in the midst of them for ever.

43:10 thou son of man, shew the hous to the hous of israel, that
they may be asham of their iniquities: and let them measur the
pattern.

43:11 and if they be asham of all that they have done, shew them the
form of the house, and the fashion thereof, and the go out
thereof, and the come in thereof, and all the form thereof, and
al the ordin thereof, and all the form thereof, and all the
law thereof: and write it in their sight, that they may keep the
whol form thereof, and all the ordin thereof, and do them.

43:12 thi is the law of the house; upon the top of the mountain the
whol limit thereof round about shall be most holy. behold, thi is
th law of the house.

43:13 and these are the measur of the altar after the cubits: the
cubit is a cubit and an hand breadth; even the bottom shall be a
cubit, and the breadth a cubit, and the border thereof by the edge
thereof round about shall be a span: and thi shall be the higher
plac of the altar.

43:14 and from the bottom upon the ground even to the lower settle
shal be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser
settl even to the greater settl shall be four cubits, and the
breadth one cubit.

43:15 So the altar shall be four cubits; and from the altar and upward
shal be four horns.

43:16 and the altar shall be twelv cubit long, twelv broad, square
in the four squar thereof.

43:17 and the settl shall be fourteen cubit long and fourteen broad
in the four squar thereof; and the border about it shall be half a
cubit; and the bottom thereof shall be a cubit about; and hi stairs
shal look toward the east.

43:18 and he said unto me, son of man, thu saith the lord god; these
ar the ordin of the altar in the day when they shall make it, to
off burnt offer thereon, and to sprinkl blood thereon.

43:19 and thou shalt give to the priest the levit that be of the
se of zadok, which approach unto me, to minist unto me, saith the
lord god, a young bullock for a sin offering.

43:20 and thou shalt take of the blood thereof, and put it on the four
horn of it, and on the four corner of the settle, and upon the
bord round about: thu shalt thou cleans and purg it.

43:21 thou shalt take the bullock also of the sin offering, and he
shal burn it in the appoint place of the house, without the
sanctuary.

43:22 and on the second day thou shalt offer a kid of the goats
without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleans the altar,
a they did cleans it with the bullock.

43:23 when thou hast made an end of cleans it, thou shalt offer a
young bullock without blemish, and a ram out of the flock without
blemish.

43:24 and thou shalt offer them befor the lord, and the priest shall
cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering
unto the lord.

43:25 seven day shalt thou prepar everi day a goat for a sin
offering: they shall also prepar a young bullock, and a ram out of
th flock, without blemish.

43:26 seven day shall they purg the altar and purifi it; and they
shal consecr themselves.

43:27 and when these day are expired, it shall be, that upon the
eighth day, and so forward, the priest shall make your burnt
off upon the altar, and your peac offerings; and I will accept
you, saith the lord god.

44:1 then he brought me back the way of the gate of the outward
sanctuari which looketh toward the east; and it wa shut.

44:2 then said the lord unto me; thi gate shall be shut, it shall not
b opened, and no man shall enter in by it; becaus the lord, the god
of israel, hath enter in by it, therefor it shall be shut.

44:3 It is for the prince; the prince, he shall sit in it to eat bread
befor the lord; he shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate,
and shall go out by the way of the same.

44:4 then brought he me the way of the north gate befor the house:
and I looked, and, behold, the glori of the lord fill the hous of
th lord: and I fell upon my face.

44:5 and the lord said unto me, son of man, mark well, and behold with
thin eyes, and hear with thine ear all that I say unto thee
concern all the ordin of the hous of the lord, and all the
law thereof; and mark well the enter in of the house, with every
go forth of the sanctuary.

44:6 and thou shalt say to the rebellious, even to the hous of
israel, thu saith the lord god; O ye hous of israel, let it suffice
y of all your abominations, 44:7 In that ye have brought into my
sanctuari strangers, uncircumcis in heart, and uncircumcis in
flesh, to be in my sanctuary, to pollut it, even my house, when ye
off my bread, the fat and the blood, and they have broken my
coven becaus of all your abominations.

44:8 and ye have not kept the charg of mine holi things: but ye have
set keeper of my charg in my sanctuari for yourselves.

44:9 thu saith the lord god; No stranger, uncircumcis in heart, nor
uncircumcis in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of ani stranger
that is among the children of israel.

44:10 and the levit that are gone away far from me, when israel went
astray, which went astray away from me after their idols; they shall
even bear their iniquity.

44:11 yet they shall be minist in my sanctuary, have charg at
th gate of the house, and minist to the house: they shall slay
th burnt offer and the sacrific for the people, and they shall
stand befor them to minist unto them.

44:12 becaus they minist unto them befor their idols, and caused
th hous of israel to fall into iniquity; therefor have I lift up
min hand against them, saith the lord god, and they shall bear their
iniquity.

44:13 and they shall not come near unto me, to do the offic of a
priest unto me, nor to come near to ani of my holi things, in the most
holi place: but they shall bear their shame, and their abominations
which they have committed.

44:14 but I will make them keeper of the charg of the house, for all
th servic thereof, and for all that shall be done therein.

44:15 but the priest the levites, the son of zadok, that kept the
charg of my sanctuari when the children of israel went astray from
me, they shall come near to me to minist unto me, and they shall
stand befor me to offer unto me the fat and the blood, saith the lord
god: 44:16 they shall enter into my sanctuary, and they shall come
near to my table, to minist unto me, and they shall keep my charge.

44:17 and it shall come to pass, that when they enter in at the gates
of the inner court, they shall be cloth with linen garments; and no
wool shall come upon them, while they minist in the gate of the
inn court, and within.

44:18 they shall have linen bonnet upon their heads, and shall have
linen breech upon their loins; they shall not gird themselv with
ani thing that causeth sweat.

44:19 and when they go forth into the utter court, even into the utter
court to the people, they shall put off their garment wherein they
ministered, and lay them in the holi chambers, and they shall put on
oth garments; and they shall not sanctifi the peopl with their
garments.

44:20 neither shall they shave their heads, nor suffer their lock to
grow long; they shall onli poll their heads.

44:21 neither shall ani priest drink wine, when they enter into the
inn court.

44:22 neither shall they take for their wive a widow, nor her that is
put away: but they shall take maiden of the seed of the hous of
israel, or a widow that had a priest before.

44:23 and they shall teach my peopl the differ between the holy
and profane, and caus them to discern between the unclean and the
clean.

44:24 and in controversi they shall stand in judgment; and they shall
judg it accord to my judgments: and they shall keep my law and my
statut in all mine assemblies; and they shall hallow my sabbaths.

44:25 and they shall come at no dead person to defil themselves: but
for father, or for mother, or for son, or for daughter, for brother,
or for sister that hath had no husband, they may defil themselves.

44:26 and after he is cleansed, they shall reckon unto him seven days.

44:27 and in the day that he goeth into the sanctuary, unto the inner
court, to minist in the sanctuary, he shall offer hi sin offering,
saith the lord god.

44:28 and it shall be unto them for an inheritance: I am their
inheritance: and ye shall give them no possess in israel: I am
their possession.

44:29 they shall eat the meat offering, and the sin offering, and the
trespass offering: and everi dedic thing in israel shall be
theirs.

44:30 and the first of all the firstfruit of all things, and every
obl of all, of everi sort of your oblations, shall be the
priest's: ye shall also give unto the priest the first of your dough,
that he may caus the bless to rest in thine house.

44:31 the priest shall not eat of ani thing that is dead of itself,
or torn, whether it be fowl or beast.

45:1 moreover, when ye shall divid by lot the land for inheritance,
y shall offer an oblat unto the lord, an holi portion of the land:
th length shall be the length of five and twenti thousand reeds, and
th breadth shall be ten thousand. thi shall be holi in all the
bord thereof round about.

45:2 Of thi there shall be for the sanctuari five hundr in length,
with five hundr in breadth, squar round about; and fifti cubits
round about for the suburb thereof.

45:3 and of thi measur shalt thou measur the length of five and
twenti thousand, and the breadth of ten thousand: and in it shall be
th sanctuari and the most holi place.

45:4 the holi portion of the land shall be for the priest the
minist of the sanctuary, which shall come near to minist unto the
lord: and it shall be a place for their houses, and an holi place for
th sanctuary.

45:5 and the five and twenti thousand of length, and the ten thousand
of breadth shall also the levites, the minist of the house, have
for themselves, for a possess for twenti chambers.

45:6 and ye shall appoint the possess of the citi five thousand
broad, and five and twenti thousand long, over against the oblat of
th holi portion: it shall be for the whole hous of israel.

45:7 and a portion shall be for the princ on the one side and on the
oth side of the oblat of the holi portion, and of the possession
of the city, befor the oblat of the holi portion, and befor the
possess of the city, from the west side westward, and from the east
sid eastward: and the length shall be over against one of the
portions, from the west border unto the east border.

45:8 In the land shall be hi possess in israel: and my princes
shal no more oppress my people; and the rest of the land shall they
giv to the hous of israel accord to their tribes.

45:9 thu saith the lord god; let it suffic you, O princ of israel:
remov violenc and spoil, and execut judgment and justice, take away
your exact from my people, saith the lord god.

45:10 Ye shall have just balances, and a just ephah, and a just bath.

45:11 the ephah and the bath shall be of one measure, that the bath
may contain the tenth part of an homer, and the ephah the tenth part
of an homer: the measur thereof shall be after the homer.

45:12 and the shekel shall be twenti gerahs: twenti shekels, five and
twenti shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your maneh.

45:13 thi is the oblat that ye shall offer; the sixth part of an
ephah of an homer of wheat, and ye shall give the sixth part of an
ephah of an homer of barley: 45:14 concern the ordin of oil,
th bath of oil, ye shall offer the tenth part of a bath out of the
cor, which is an homer of ten baths; for ten bath are an homer: 45:15
and one lamb out of the flock, out of two hundred, out of the fat
pastur of israel; for a meat offering, and for a burnt offering, and
for peac offerings, to make reconcili for them, saith the lord
god.

45:16 all the peopl of the land shall give thi oblat for the
princ in israel.

45:17 and it shall be the prince' part to give burnt offerings, and
meat offerings, and drink offerings, in the feasts, and in the new
moons, and in the sabbaths, in all solemn of the hous of israel:
h shall prepar the sin offering, and the meat offering, and the
burnt offering, and the peac offerings, to make reconcili for
th hous of israel.

45:18 thu saith the lord god; In the first month, in the first day of
th month, thou shalt take a young bullock without blemish, and
cleans the sanctuary: 45:19 and the priest shall take of the blood of
th sin offering, and put it upon the post of the house, and upon the
four corner of the settl of the altar, and upon the post of the
gat of the inner court.

45:20 and so thou shalt do the seventh day of the month for everi one
that erreth, and for him that is simple: so shall ye reconcil the
house.

45:21 In the first month, in the fourteenth day of the month, ye shall
hav the passover, a feast of seven days; unleaven bread shall be
eaten.

45:22 and upon that day shall the princ prepar for himself and for
al the peopl of the land a bullock for a sin offering.

45:23 and seven day of the feast he shall prepar a burnt offer to
th lord, seven bullock and seven ram without blemish daili the
seven days; and a kid of the goat daili for a sin offering.

45:24 and he shall prepar a meat offer of an ephah for a bullock,
and an ephah for a ram, and an hin of oil for an ephah.

45:25 In the seventh month, in the fifteenth day of the month, shall
h do the like in the feast of the seven days, accord to the sin
offering, accord to the burnt offering, and accord to the meat
offering, and accord to the oil.

46:1 thu saith the lord god; the gate of the inner court that looketh
toward the east shall be shut the six work days; but on the sabbath
it shall be opened, and in the day of the new moon it shall be opened.

46:2 and the princ shall enter by the way of the porch of that gate
without, and shall stand by the post of the gate, and the priests
shal prepar hi burnt offer and hi peac offerings, and he shall
worship at the threshold of the gate: then he shall go forth; but the
gat shall not be shut until the evening.

46:3 likewis the peopl of the land shall worship at the door of this
gat befor the lord in the sabbath and in the new moons.

46:4 and the burnt offer that the princ shall offer unto the lord
in the sabbath day shall be six lamb without blemish, and a ram
without blemish.

46:5 and the meat offer shall be an ephah for a ram, and the meat
off for the lamb as he shall be abl to give, and an hin of oil
to an ephah.

46:6 and in the day of the new moon it shall be a young bullock
without blemish, and six lambs, and a ram: they shall be without
blemish.

46:7 and he shall prepar a meat offering, an ephah for a bullock, and
an ephah for a ram, and for the lamb accord as hi hand shall
attain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah.

46:8 and when the princ shall enter, he shall go in by the way of the
porch of that gate, and he shall go forth by the way thereof.

46:9 but when the peopl of the land shall come befor the lord in the
solemn feasts, he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to
worship shall go out by the way of the south gate; and he that
entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the
north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate wherebi he came
in, but shall go forth over against it.

46:10 and the princ in the midst of them, when they go in, shall go
in; and when they go forth, shall go forth.

46:11 and in the feast and in the solemn the meat offer shall
b an ephah to a bullock, and an ephah to a ram, and to the lamb as
h is abl to give, and an hin of oil to an ephah.

46:12 now when the princ shall prepar a voluntari burnt offer or
peac offer voluntarili unto the lord, one shall then open him the
gat that looketh toward the east, and he shall prepar hi burnt
off and hi peac offerings, as he did on the sabbath day: then
h shall go forth; and after hi go forth one shall shut the gate.

46:13 thou shalt daili prepar a burnt offer unto the lord of a
lamb of the first year without blemish: thou shalt prepar it every
morning.

46:14 and thou shalt prepar a meat offer for it everi morning, the
sixth part of an ephah, and the third part of an hin of oil, to temper
with the fine flour; a meat offer continu by a perpetual
ordin unto the lord.

46:15 thu shall they prepar the lamb, and the meat offering, and the
oil, everi morn for a continu burnt offering.

46:16 thu saith the lord god; If the princ give a gift unto ani of
hi sons, the inherit thereof shall be hi sons'; it shall be
their possess by inheritance.

46:17 but if he give a gift of hi inherit to one of hi servants,
then it shall be hi to the year of liberty; after it shall return to
th prince: but hi inherit shall be hi sons' for them.

46:18 moreov the princ shall not take of the people' inheritance
bi oppression, to thrust them out of their possession; but he shall
giv hi son inherit out of hi own possession: that my peopl be
not scatter everi man from hi possession.

46:19 after he brought me through the entry, which wa at the side of
th gate, into the holi chamber of the priests, which look toward
th north: and, behold, there wa a place on the two side westward.

46:20 then said he unto me, thi is the place where the priest shall
boil the trespass offer and the sin offering, where they shall bake
th meat offering; that they bear them not out into the utter court,
to sanctifi the people.

46:21 then he brought me forth into the utter court, and caus me to
pass by the four corner of the court; and, behold, in everi corner of
th court there wa a court.

46:22 In the four corner of the court there were court join of
forti cubit long and thirti broad: these four corner were of one
measure.

46:23 and there wa a row of build round about in them, round about
them four, and it wa made with boil place under the row round
about.

46:24 then said he unto me, these are the place of them that boil,
wher the minist of the hous shall boil the sacrific of the
people.

47:1 afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house; and,
behold, water issu out from under the threshold of the house
eastward: for the forefront of the hous stood toward the east, and
th water came down from under from the right side of the house, at
th south side of the altar.

47:2 then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward, and led
m about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh
eastward; and, behold, there ran out water on the right side.

47:3 and when the man that had the line in hi hand went forth
eastward, he measur a thousand cubits, and he brought me through the
waters; the water were to the ankles.

47:4 again he measur a thousand, and brought me through the waters;
th water were to the knees. again he measur a thousand, and
brought me through; the water were to the loins.

47:5 afterward he measur a thousand; and it wa a river that I could
not pass over: for the water were risen, water to swim in, a river
that could not be pass over.

47:6 and he said unto me, son of man, hast thou seen this? then he
brought me, and caus me to return to the brink of the river.

47:7 now when I had returned, behold, at the bank of the river were
veri mani tree on the one side and on the other.

47:8 then said he unto me, these water issu out toward the east
country, and go down into the desert, and go into the sea: which being
brought forth into the sea, the water shall be healed.

47:9 and it shall come to pass, that everi thing that liveth, which
moveth, whithersoev the river shall come, shall live: and there
shal be a veri great multitud of fish, becaus these water shall
com thither: for they shall be healed; and everi thing shall live
whith the river cometh.

47:10 and it shall come to pass, that the fisher shall stand upon it
from engedi even unto eneglaim; they shall be a place to spread forth
nets; their fish shall be accord to their kinds, as the fish of the
great sea, exceed many.

47:11 but the miri place thereof and the marish thereof shall not
b healed; they shall be given to salt.

47:12 and by the river upon the bank thereof, on thi side and on that
side, shall grow all tree for meat, whose leaf shall not fade,
neith shall the fruit thereof be consumed: it shall bring forth new
fruit accord to hi months, becaus their water they issu out of
th sanctuary: and the fruit thereof shall be for meat, and the leaf
thereof for medicine.

47:13 thu saith the lord god; thi shall be the border, wherebi ye
shal inherit the land accord to the twelv tribe of israel:
joseph shall have two portions.

47:14 and ye shall inherit it, one as well as another: concern the
which I lift up mine hand to give it unto your fathers: and this
land shall fall unto you for inheritance.

47:15 and thi shall be the border of the land toward the north side,
from the great sea, the way of hethlon, as men go to zedad; 47:16
hamath, berothah, sibraim, which is between the border of damascu and
th border of hamath; hazarhatticon, which is by the coast of hauran.

47:17 and the border from the sea shall be hazarenan, the border of
damascus, and the north northward, and the border of hamath. and this
i the north side.

47:18 and the east side ye shall measur from hauran, and from
damascus, and from gilead, and from the land of israel by jordan, from
th border unto the east sea. and thi is the east side.

47:19 and the south side southward, from tamar even to the water of
strif in kadesh, the river to the great sea. and thi is the south
sid southward.

47:20 the west side also shall be the great sea from the border, till
a man come over against hamath. thi is the west side.

47:21 So shall ye divid thi land unto you accord to the tribe of
israel.

47:22 and it shall come to pass, that ye shall divid it by lot for an
inherit unto you, and to the stranger that sojourn among you,
which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as
born in the countri among the children of israel; they shall have
inherit with you among the tribe of israel.

47:23 and it shall come to pass, that in what tribe the stranger
sojourneth, there shall ye give him hi inheritance, saith the lord
god.

48:1 now these are the name of the tribes. from the north end to the
coast of the way of hethlon, as one goeth to hamath, hazarenan, the
bord of damascu northward, to the coast of hamath; for these are
hi side east and west; a portion for dan.

48:2 and by the border of dan, from the east side unto the west side,
a portion for asher.

48:3 and by the border of asher, from the east side even unto the west
side, a portion for naphtali.

48:4 and by the border of naphtali, from the east side unto the west
side, a portion for manasseh.

48:5 and by the border of manasseh, from the east side unto the west
side, a portion for ephraim.

48:6 and by the border of ephraim, from the east side even unto the
west side, a portion for reuben.

48:7 and by the border of reuben, from the east side unto the west
side, a portion for judah.

48:8 and by the border of judah, from the east side unto the west
side, shall be the offer which ye shall offer of five and twenty
thousand reed in breadth, and in length as one of the other parts,
from the east side unto the west side: and the sanctuari shall be in
th midst of it.

48:9 the oblat that ye shall offer unto the lord shall be of five
and twenti thousand in length, and of ten thousand in breadth.

48:10 and for them, even for the priests, shall be thi holi oblation;
toward the north five and twenti thousand in length, and toward the
west ten thousand in breadth, and toward the east ten thousand in
breadth, and toward the south five and twenti thousand in length: and
th sanctuari of the lord shall be in the midst thereof.

48:11 It shall be for the priest that are sanctifi of the son of
zadok; which have kept my charge, which went not astray when the
children of israel went astray, as the levit went astray.

48:12 and thi oblat of the land that is offer shall be unto them
a thing most holi by the border of the levites.

48:13 and over against the border of the priest the levit shall
hav five and twenti thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth:
al the length shall be five and twenti thousand, and the breadth ten
thousand.

48:14 and they shall not sell of it, neither exchange, nor alienate
th firstfruit of the land: for it is holi unto the lord.

48:15 and the five thousand, that are left in the breadth over against
th five and twenti thousand, shall be a profan place for the city,
for dwelling, and for suburbs: and the citi shall be in the midst
thereof.

48:16 and these shall be the measur thereof; the north side four
thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five
hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the
west side four thousand and five hundred.

48:17 and the suburb of the citi shall be toward the north two
hundr and fifty, and toward the south two hundr and fifty, and
toward the east two hundr and fifty, and toward the west two hundred
and fifty.

48:18 and the residu in length over against the oblat of the holy
port shall be ten thousand eastward, and ten thousand westward: and
it shall be over against the oblat of the holi portion; and the
increas thereof shall be for food unto them that serv the city.

48:19 and they that serv the citi shall serv it out of all the
trib of israel.

48:20 all the oblat shall be five and twenti thousand by five and
twenti thousand: ye shall offer the holi oblat foursquare, with the
possess of the city.

48:21 and the residu shall be for the prince, on the one side and on
th other of the holi oblation, and of the possess of the city,
ov against the five and twenti thousand of the oblat toward the
east border, and westward over against the five and twenti thousand
toward the west border, over against the portion for the prince: and
it shall be the holi oblation; and the sanctuari of the hous shall be
in the midst thereof.

48:22 moreov from the possess of the levites, and from the
possess of the city, be in the midst of that which is the
prince's, between the border of judah and the border of benjamin,
shal be for the prince.

48:23 As for the rest of the tribes, from the east side unto the west
side, benjamin shall have a portion.

48:24 and by the border of benjamin, from the east side unto the west
side, simeon shall have a portion.

48:25 and by the border of simeon, from the east side unto the west
side, issachar a portion.

48:26 and by the border of issachar, from the east side unto the west
side, zebulun a portion.

48:27 and by the border of zebulun, from the east side unto the west
side, gad a portion.

48:28 and by the border of gad, at the south side southward, the
bord shall be even from tamar unto the water of strife in kadesh,
and to the river toward the great sea.

48:29 thi is the land which ye shall divid by lot unto the tribe of
israel for inheritance, and these are their portions, saith the lord
god.

48:30 and these are the go out of the citi on the north side, four
thousand and five hundr measures.

48:31 and the gate of the citi shall be after the name of the tribes
of israel: three gate northward; one gate of reuben, one gate of
judah, one gate of levi.

48:32 and at the east side four thousand and five hundred: and three
gates; and one gate of joseph, one gate of benjamin, one gate of dan.

48:33 and at the south side four thousand and five hundr measures:
and three gates; one gate of simeon, one gate of issachar, one gate of
zebulun.

48:34 At the west side four thousand and five hundred, with their
thre gates; one gate of gad, one gate of asher, one gate of naphtali.

48:35 It wa round about eighteen thousand measures: and the name of
th citi from that day shall be, the lord is there.




th book of daniel


1:1 In the third year of the reign of jehoiakim king of judah came
nebuchadnezzar king of babylon unto jerusalem, and besieg it.

1:2 and the lord gave jehoiakim king of judah into hi hand, with part
of the vessel of the hous of god: which he carri into the land of
shinar to the hous of hi god; and he brought the vessel into the
treasur hous of hi god.

1:3 and the king spake unto ashpenaz the master of hi eunuchs, that
h should bring certain of the children of israel, and of the king's
seed, and of the princes; 1:4 children in whom wa no blemish, but
wel favoured, and skil in all wisdom, and cun in knowledge,
and understand science, and such as had abil in them to stand in
th king' palace, and whom they might teach the learn and the
tongu of the chaldeans.

1:5 and the king appoint them a daili provis of the king' meat,
and of the wine which he drank: so nourish them three years, that
at the end thereof they might stand befor the king.

1:6 now among these were of the children of judah, daniel, hananiah,
mishael, and azariah: 1:7 unto whom the princ of the eunuch gave
names: for he gave unto daniel the name of belteshazzar; and to
hananiah, of shadrach; and to mishael, of meshach; and to azariah, of
abednego.

1:8 but daniel purpos in hi heart that he would not defil himself
with the portion of the king' meat, nor with the wine which he drank:
therefor he request of the princ of the eunuch that he might not
defil himself.

1:9 now god had brought daniel into favour and tender love with the
princ of the eunuchs.

1:10 and the princ of the eunuch said unto daniel, I fear my lord
th king, who hath appoint your meat and your drink: for whi should
h see your face wors like than the children which are of your
sort? then shall ye make me endang my head to the king.

1:11 then said daniel to melzar, whom the princ of the eunuch had
set over daniel, hananiah, mishael, and azariah, 1:12 prove thy
servants, I beseech thee, ten days; and let them give us puls to eat,
and water to drink.

1:13 then let our counten be look upon befor thee, and the
counten of the children that eat of the portion of the king's
meat: and as thou seest, deal with thi servants.

1:14 So he consent to them in thi matter, and prove them ten days.

1:15 and at the end of ten day their counten appear fairer and
fatt in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the
king' meat.

1:16 thu melzar took away the portion of their meat, and the wine
that they should drink; and gave them pulse.

1:17 As for these four children, god gave them knowledg and skill in
al learn and wisdom: and daniel had understand in all visions
and dreams.

1:18 now at the end of the day that the king had said he should bring
them in, then the princ of the eunuch brought them in before
nebuchadnezzar.

1:19 and the king commun with them; and among them all wa found
non like daniel, hananiah, mishael, and azariah: therefor stood they
befor the king.

1:20 and in all matter of wisdom and understanding, that the king
enquir of them, he found them ten time better than all the
magician and astrolog that were in all hi realm.

1:21 and daniel continu even unto the first year of king cyrus.

2:1 and in the second year of the reign of nebuchadnezzar
nebuchadnezzar dream dreams, wherewith hi spirit wa troubled, and
hi sleep brake from him.

2:2 then the king command to call the magicians, and the
astrologers, and the sorcerers, and the chaldeans, for to shew the
k hi dreams. So they came and stood befor the king.

2:3 and the king said unto them, I have dream a dream, and my spirit
wa troubl to know the dream.

2:4 then spake the chaldean to the king in syriack, O king, live for
ever: tell thi servant the dream, and we will shew the
interpretation.

2:5 the king answer and said to the chaldeans, the thing is gone
from me: if ye will not make known unto me the dream, with the
interpret thereof, ye shall be cut in pieces, and your houses
shal be made a dunghill.

2:6 but if ye shew the dream, and the interpret thereof, ye shall
rec of me gift and reward and great honour: therefor shew me
th dream, and the interpret thereof.

2:7 they answer again and said, let the king tell hi servant the
dream, and we will shew the interpret of it.

2:8 the king answer and said, I know of certainti that ye would gain
th time, becaus ye see the thing is gone from me.

2:9 but if ye will not make known unto me the dream, there is but one
decre for you: for ye have prepar lie and corrupt word to speak
befor me, till the time be changed: therefor tell me the dream, and
i shall know that ye can shew me the interpret thereof.

2:10 the chaldean answer befor the king, and said, there is not a
man upon the earth that can shew the king' matter: therefor there is
no king, lord, nor ruler, that ask such thing at ani magician, or
astrologer, or chaldean.

2:11 and it is a rare thing that the king requireth, and there is none
oth that can shew it befor the king, except the gods, whose
dwel is not with flesh.

2:12 for thi caus the king wa angri and veri furious, and commanded
to destroy all the wise men of babylon.

2:13 and the decre went forth that the wise men should be slain; and
they sought daniel and hi fellow to be slain.

2:14 then daniel answer with counsel and wisdom to arioch the
captain of the king' guard, which wa gone forth to slay the wise men
of babylon: 2:15 He answer and said to arioch the king' captain,
whi is the decre so hasti from the king? then arioch made the thing
known to daniel.

2:16 then daniel went in, and desir of the king that he would give
him time, and that he would shew the king the interpretation.

2:17 then daniel went to hi house, and made the thing known to
hananiah, mishael, and azariah, hi companions: 2:18 that they would
desir merci of the god of heaven concern thi secret; that
daniel and hi fellow should not perish with the rest of the wise men
of babylon.

2:19 then wa the secret reveal unto daniel in a night vision. then
daniel bless the god of heaven.

2:20 daniel answer and said, bless be the name of god for ever and
ever: for wisdom and might are his: 2:21 and he changeth the time and
th seasons: he removeth kings, and setteth up kings: he giveth wisdom
unto the wise, and knowledg to them that know understanding: 2:22 he
revealeth the deep and secret things: he knoweth what is in the
darkness, and the light dwelleth with him.

2:23 I thank thee, and prais thee, O thou god of my fathers, who hast
given me wisdom and might, and hast made known unto me now what we
desir of thee: for thou hast now made known unto us the king's
matter.

2:24 therefor daniel went in unto arioch, whom the king had ordained
to destroy the wise men of babylon: he went and said thu unto him;
destroy not the wise men of babylon: bring me in befor the king, and
i will shew unto the king the interpretation.

2:25 then arioch brought in daniel befor the king in haste, and said
thu unto him, I have found a man of the captiv of judah, that will
mak known unto the king the interpretation.

2:26 the king answer and said to daniel, whose name was
belteshazzar, art thou abl to make known unto me the dream which i
hav seen, and the interpret thereof?  2:27 daniel answer in
th presenc of the king, and said, the secret which the king hath
demand cannot the wise men, the astrologers, the magicians, the
soothsayers, shew unto the king; 2:28 but there is a god in heaven
that revealeth secrets, and maketh known to the king nebuchadnezzar
what shall be in the latter days. thi dream, and the vision of thy
head upon thi bed, are these; 2:29 As for thee, O king, thi thoughts
cam into thi mind upon thi bed, what should come to pass hereafter:
and he that revealeth secret maketh known to thee what shall come to
pass.

2:30 but as for me, thi secret is not reveal to me for ani wisdom
that I have more than ani living, but for their sake that shall make
known the interpret to the king, and that thou mightest know the
thought of thi heart.

2:31 thou, O king, sawest, and behold a great image. thi great image,
whos bright wa excellent, stood befor thee; and the form
thereof wa terrible.

2:32 thi image' head wa of fine gold, hi breast and hi arm of
silver, hi belli and hi thigh of brass, 2:33 hi leg of iron, his
feet part of iron and part of clay.

2:34 thou sawest till that a stone wa cut out without hands, which
smot the imag upon hi feet that were of iron and clay, and brake
them to pieces.

2:35 then wa the iron, the clay, the brass, the silver, and the gold,
broken to piec together, and becam like the chaff of the summer
threshingfloors; and the wind carri them away, that no place was
found for them: and the stone that smote the imag becam a great
mountain, and fill the whole earth.

2:36 thi is the dream; and we will tell the interpret thereof
befor the king.

2:37 thou, O king, art a king of kings: for the god of heaven hath
given thee a kingdom, power, and strength, and glory.

2:38 and wheresoev the children of men dwell, the beast of the
field and the fowl of the heaven hath he given into thine hand, and
hath made thee ruler over them all. thou art thi head of gold.

2:39 and after thee shall aris anoth kingdom inferior to thee, and
anoth third kingdom of brass, which shall bear rule over all the
earth.

2:40 and the fourth kingdom shall be strong as iron: forasmuch as iron
breaketh in piec and subdueth all things: and as iron that breaketh
al these, shall it break in piec and bruise.

2:41 and wherea thou sawest the feet and toes, part of potters' clay,
and part of iron, the kingdom shall be divided; but there shall be in
it of the strength of the iron, forasmuch as thou sawest the iron
mix with miri clay.

2:42 and as the toe of the feet were part of iron, and part of clay,
so the kingdom shall be partli strong, and partli broken.

2:43 and wherea thou sawest iron mix with miri clay, they shall
mingl themselv with the seed of men: but they shall not cleav one
to another, even as iron is not mix with clay.

2:44 and in the day of these king shall the god of heaven set up a
kingdom, which shall never be destroyed: and the kingdom shall not be
left to other people, but it shall break in piec and consum all
thes kingdoms, and it shall stand for ever.

2:45 forasmuch as thou sawest that the stone wa cut out of the
mountain without hands, and that it brake in piec the iron, the
brass, the clay, the silver, and the gold; the great god hath made
known to the king what shall come to pass hereafter: and the dream is
certain, and the interpret thereof sure.

2:46 then the king nebuchadnezzar fell upon hi face, and worshipped
daniel, and command that they should offer an oblat and sweet
odour unto him.

2:47 the king answer unto daniel, and said, Of a truth it is, that
your god is a god of gods, and a lord of kings, and a reveal of
secrets, see thou couldest reveal thi secret.

2:48 then the king made daniel a great man, and gave him mani great
gifts, and made him ruler over the whole provinc of babylon, and
chief of the governor over all the wise men of babylon.

2:49 then daniel request of the king, and he set shadrach, meshach,
and abednego, over the affair of the provinc of babylon: but daniel
sat in the gate of the king.

3:1 nebuchadnezzar the king made an imag of gold, whose height was
threescor cubits, and the breadth thereof six cubits: he set it up in
th plain of dura, in the provinc of babylon.

3:2 then nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather togeth the princes,
th governors, and the captains, the judges, the treasurers, the
counsellors, the sheriffs, and all the ruler of the provinces, to
com to the dedic of the imag which nebuchadnezzar the king had
set up.

3:3 then the princes, the governors, and captains, the judges, the
treasurers, the counsellors, the sheriffs, and all the ruler of the
provinces, were gather togeth unto the dedic of the image
that nebuchadnezzar the king had set up; and they stood befor the
imag that nebuchadnezzar had set up.

3:4 then an herald cri aloud, To you it is commanded, O people,
nations, and languages, 3:5 that at what time ye hear the sound of the
cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, dulcimer, and all kind of
musick, ye fall down and worship the golden imag that nebuchadnezzar
th king hath set up: 3:6 and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth
shal the same hour be cast into the midst of a burn fieri furnace.

3:7 therefor at that time, when all the peopl heard the sound of the
cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and all kind of musick, all
th people, the nations, and the languages, fell down and worshipped
th golden imag that nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

3:8 wherefor at that time certain chaldean came near, and accused
th jews.

3:9 they spake and said to the king nebuchadnezzar, O king, live for
ever.

3:10 thou, O king, hast made a decree, that everi man that shall hear
th sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and dulcimer,
and all kind of musick, shall fall down and worship the golden image:
3:11 and whoso falleth not down and worshippeth, that he should be
cast into the midst of a burn fieri furnace.

3:12 there are certain jew whom thou hast set over the affair of the
provinc of babylon, shadrach, meshach, and abednego; these men, o
king, have not regard thee: they serv not thi gods, nor worship the
golden imag which thou hast set up.

3:13 then nebuchadnezzar in hi rage and furi command to bring
shadrach, meshach, and abednego. then they brought these men before
th king.

3:14 nebuchadnezzar spake and said unto them, Is it true, O shadrach,
meshach, and abednego, do not ye serv my gods, nor worship the golden
imag which I have set up?  3:15 now if ye be readi that at what time
y hear the sound of the cornet, flute, harp, sackbut, psaltery, and
dulcimer, and all kind of musick, ye fall down and worship the image
which I have made; well: but if ye worship not, ye shall be cast the
sam hour into the midst of a burn fieri furnace; and who is that
god that shall deliv you out of my hands?  3:16 shadrach, meshach,
and abednego, answer and said to the king, O nebuchadnezzar, we are
not care to answer thee in thi matter.

3:17 If it be so, our god whom we serv is abl to deliv us from the
burn fieri furnace, and he will deliv us out of thine hand, o
king.

3:18 but if not, be it known unto thee, O king, that we will not serve
thi gods, nor worship the golden imag which thou hast set up.

3:19 then wa nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and the form of hi visage
wa chang against shadrach, meshach, and abednego: therefor he
spake, and command that they should heat the furnac one seven times
mor than it wa wont to be heated.

3:20 and he command the most mighti men that were in hi armi to
bind shadrach, meshach, and abednego, and to cast them into the
burn fieri furnace.

3:21 then these men were bound in their coats, their hosen, and their
hats, and their other garments, and were cast into the midst of the
burn fieri furnace.

3:22 therefor becaus the king' command wa urgent, and the
furnac exceed hot, the flame of the fire slew those men that took
up shadrach, meshach, and abednego.

3:23 and these three men, shadrach, meshach, and abednego, fell down
bound into the midst of the burn fieri furnace.

3:24 then nebuchadnezzar the king wa astonied, and rose up in haste,
and spake, and said unto hi counsellors, did not we cast three men
bound into the midst of the fire? they answer and said unto the
king, true, O king.

3:25 He answer and said, lo, I see four men loose, walk in the
midst of the fire, and they have no hurt; and the form of the fourth
i like the son of god.

3:26 then nebuchadnezzar came near to the mouth of the burn fiery
furnace, and spake, and said, shadrach, meshach, and abednego, ye
serv of the most high god, come forth, and come hither. then
shadrach, meshach, and abednego, came forth of the midst of the fire.

3:27 and the princes, governors, and captains, and the king's
counsellors, be gather together, saw these men, upon whose bodies
th fire had no power, nor wa an hair of their head singed, neither
wer their coat changed, nor the smell of fire had pass on them.

3:28 then nebuchadnezzar spake, and said, bless be the god of
shadrach, meshach, and abednego, who hath sent hi angel, and
deliv hi servant that trust in him, and have chang the
king' word, and yield their bodies, that they might not serv nor
worship ani god, except their own god.

3:29 therefor I make a decree, that everi people, nation, and
language, which speak ani thing amiss against the god of shadrach,
meshach, and abednego, shall be cut in pieces, and their hous shall
b made a dunghill: becaus there is no other god that can deliver
aft thi sort.

3:30 then the king promot shadrach, meshach, and abednego, in the
provinc of babylon.

4:1 nebuchadnezzar the king, unto all people, nations, and languages,
that dwell in all the earth; peac be multipli unto you.

4:2 I thought it good to shew the sign and wonder that the high god
hath wrought toward me.

4:3 how great are hi signs! and how mighti are hi wonders! his
kingdom is an everlast kingdom, and hi dominion is from generation
to generation.

4:4 I nebuchadnezzar wa at rest in mine house, and flourish in my
palace: 4:5 I saw a dream which made me afraid, and the thought upon
mi bed and the vision of my head troubl me.

4:6 therefor made I a decre to bring in all the wise men of babylon
befor me, that they might make known unto me the interpret of
th dream.

4:7 then came in the magicians, the astrologers, the chaldeans, and
th soothsayers: and I told the dream befor them; but they did not
mak known unto me the interpret thereof.

4:8 but at the last daniel came in befor me, whose name was
belteshazzar, accord to the name of my god, and in whom is the
spirit of the holi gods: and befor him I told the dream, saying, 4:9
o belteshazzar, master of the magicians, becaus I know that the
spirit of the holi god is in thee, and no secret troubleth thee, tell
m the vision of my dream that I have seen, and the interpretation
thereof.

4:10 thu were the vision of mine head in my bed; I saw, and behold a
tre in the midst of the earth, and the height thereof wa great.

4:11 the tree grew, and wa strong, and the height thereof reached
unto heaven, and the sight thereof to the end of all the earth: 4:12
the leav thereof were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in it
wa meat for all: the beast of the field had shadow under it, and the
fowl of the heaven dwelt in the bough thereof, and all flesh wa fed
of it.

4:13 I saw in the vision of my head upon my bed, and, behold, a
watch and an holi one came down from heaven; 4:14 He cri aloud,
and said thus, hew down the tree, and cut off hi branches, shake off
hi leaves, and scatter hi fruit: let the beast get away from under
it, and the fowl from hi branches: 4:15 nevertheless leav the stump
of hi root in the earth, even with a band of iron and brass, in the
tend grass of the field; and let it be wet with the dew of heaven,
and let hi portion be with the beast in the grass of the earth: 4:16
let hi heart be chang from man's, and let a beast' heart be given
unto him; and let seven time pass over him.

4:17 thi matter is by the decre of the watchers, and the demand by
th word of the holi ones: to the intent that the live may know that
th most high ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to
whomsoev he will, and setteth up over it the basest of men.

4:18 thi dream I king nebuchadnezzar have seen. now thou, o
belteshazzar, declar the interpret thereof, forasmuch as all the
wis men of my kingdom are not abl to make known unto me the
interpretation: but thou art able; for the spirit of the holi god is
in thee.

4:19 then daniel, whose name wa belteshazzar, wa astoni for one
hour, and hi thought troubl him. the king spake, and said,
belteshazzar, let not the dream, or the interpret thereof,
troubl thee. belteshazzar answer and said, My lord, the dream be to
them that hate thee, and the interpret thereof to thine enemies.

4:20 the tree that thou sawest, which grew, and wa strong, whose
height reach unto the heaven, and the sight thereof to all the
earth; 4:21 whose leav were fair, and the fruit thereof much, and in
it wa meat for all; under which the beast of the field dwelt, and
upon whose branch the fowl of the heaven had their habitation: 4:22
it is thou, O king, that art grown and becom strong: for thy
great is grown, and reacheth unto heaven, and thi dominion to the
end of the earth.

4:23 and wherea the king saw a watcher and an holi one come down
from heaven, and saying, hew the tree down, and destroy it; yet leave
th stump of the root thereof in the earth, even with a band of iron
and brass, in the tender grass of the field; and let it be wet with
th dew of heaven, and let hi portion be with the beast of the
field, till seven time pass over him; 4:24 thi is the
interpretation, O king, and thi is the decre of the most high, which
i come upon my lord the king: 4:25 that they shall drive thee from
men, and thi dwell shall be with the beast of the field, and they
shal make thee to eat grass as oxen, and they shall wet thee with the
dew of heaven, and seven time shall pass over thee, till thou know
that the most high ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to
whomsoev he will.

4:26 and wherea they command to leav the stump of the tree roots;
thi kingdom shall be sure unto thee, after that thou shalt have known
that the heaven do rule.

4:27 wherefore, O king, let my counsel be accept unto thee, and
break off thi sin by righteousness, and thine iniqu by shewing
merci to the poor; if it may be a lengthen of thi tranquillity.

4:28 all thi came upon the king nebuchadnezzar.

4:29 At the end of twelv month he walk in the palac of the
kingdom of babylon.

4:30 the king spake, and said, Is not thi great babylon, that I have
built for the hous of the kingdom by the might of my power, and for
th honour of my majesty?  4:31 while the word wa in the king's
mouth, there fell a voic from heaven, saying, O king nebuchadnezzar,
to thee it is spoken; the kingdom is depart from thee.

4:32 and they shall drive thee from men, and thi dwell shall be
with the beast of the field: they shall make thee to eat grass as
oxen, and seven time shall pass over thee, until thou know that the
most high ruleth in the kingdom of men, and giveth it to whomsoev he
will.

4:33 the same hour wa the thing fulfil upon nebuchadnezzar: and he
wa driven from men, and did eat grass as oxen, and hi bodi wa wet
with the dew of heaven, till hi hair were grown like eagles'
feathers, and hi nail like birds' claws.

4:34 and at the end of the day I nebuchadnezzar lift up mine eyes
unto heaven, and mine understand return unto me, and I blessed
th most high, and I prais and honour him that liveth for ever,
whos dominion is an everlast dominion, and hi kingdom is from
gener to generation: 4:35 and all the inhabit of the earth
ar reput as nothing: and he doeth accord to hi will in the army
of heaven, and among the inhabit of the earth: and none can stay
hi hand, or say unto him, what doest thou?  4:36 At the same time my
reason return unto me; and for the glori of my kingdom, mine honour
and bright return unto me; and my counsellor and my lords
sought unto me; and I wa establish in my kingdom, and excellent
majesti wa ad unto me.

4:37 now I nebuchadnezzar prais and extol and honour the king of
heaven, all whose work are truth, and hi way judgment: and those
that walk in pride he is abl to abase.

5:1 belshazzar the king made a great feast to a thousand of hi lords,
and drank wine befor the thousand.

5:2 belshazzar, while he tast the wine, command to bring the
golden and silver vessel which hi father nebuchadnezzar had taken
out of the templ which wa in jerusalem; that the king, and his
princes, hi wives, and hi concubines, might drink therein.

5:3 then they brought the golden vessel that were taken out of the
templ of the hous of god which wa at jerusalem; and the king, and
hi princes, hi wives, and hi concubines, drank in them.

5:4 they drank wine, and prais the god of gold, and of silver, of
brass, of iron, of wood, and of stone.

5:5 In the same hour came forth finger of a man' hand, and wrote
ov against the candlestick upon the plaister of the wall of the
king' palace: and the king saw the part of the hand that wrote.

5:6 then the king' counten wa changed, and hi thought troubled
him, so that the joint of hi loin were loosed, and hi knee smote
on against another.

5:7 the king cri aloud to bring in the astrologers, the chaldeans,
and the soothsayers. and the king spake, and said to the wise men of
babylon, whosoev shall read thi writing, and shew me the
interpret thereof, shall be cloth with scarlet, and have a
chain of gold about hi neck, and shall be the third ruler in the
kingdom.

5:8 then came in all the king' wise men: but they could not read the
writing, nor make known to the king the interpret thereof.

5:9 then wa king belshazzar greatli troubled, and hi counten was
chang in him, and hi lord were astonied.

5:10 now the queen by reason of the word of the king and hi lords
cam into the banquet house: and the queen spake and said, O king,
liv for ever: let not thi thought troubl thee, nor let thy
counten be changed: 5:11 there is a man in thi kingdom, in whom is
th spirit of the holi gods; and in the day of thi father light and
understand and wisdom, like the wisdom of the gods, wa found in
him; whom the king nebuchadnezzar thi father, the king, I say, thy
father, made master of the magicians, astrologers, chaldeans, and
soothsayers; 5:12 forasmuch as an excel spirit, and knowledge, and
understanding, interpret of dreams, and shew of hard sentences,
and dissolv of doubts, were found in the same daniel, whom the king
nam belteshazzar: now let daniel be called, and he will shew the
interpretation.

5:13 then wa daniel brought in befor the king. and the king spake
and said unto daniel, art thou that daniel, which art of the children
of the captiv of judah, whom the king my father brought out of
jewry?  5:14 I have even heard of thee, that the spirit of the god is
in thee, and that light and understand and excel wisdom is
found in thee.

5:15 and now the wise men, the astrologers, have been brought in
befor me, that they should read thi writing, and make known unto me
th interpret thereof: but they could not shew the interpretation
of the thing: 5:16 and I have heard of thee, that thou canst make
interpretations, and dissolv doubts: now if thou canst read the
writing, and make known to me the interpret thereof, thou shalt
b cloth with scarlet, and have a chain of gold about thi neck, and
shalt be the third ruler in the kingdom.

5:17 then daniel answer and said befor the king, let thi gift be
to thyself, and give thi reward to another; yet I will read the
writ unto the king, and make known to him the interpretation.

5:18 O thou king, the most high god gave nebuchadnezzar thi father a
kingdom, and majesty, and glory, and honour: 5:19 and for the majesty
that he gave him, all people, nations, and languages, trembl and
fear befor him: whom he would he slew; and whom he would he kept
alive; and whom he would he set up; and whom he would he put down.

5:20 but when hi heart wa lift up, and hi mind harden in pride,
h wa depos from hi kingli throne, and they took hi glori from
him: 5:21 and he wa driven from the son of men; and hi heart was
mad like the beasts, and hi dwell wa with the wild asses: they
f him with grass like oxen, and hi bodi wa wet with the dew of
heaven; till he knew that the most high god rule in the kingdom of
men, and that he appointeth over it whomsoev he will.

5:22 and thou hi son, O belshazzar, hast not humbl thine heart,
though thou knewest all this; 5:23 but hast lift up thyself against
th lord of heaven; and they have brought the vessel of hi house
befor thee, and thou, and thi lords, thi wives, and thi concubines,
hav drunk wine in them; and thou hast prais the god of silver, and
gold, of brass, iron, wood, and stone, which see not, nor hear, nor
know: and the god in whose hand thi breath is, and whose are all thy
ways, hast thou not glorified: 5:24 then wa the part of the hand sent
from him; and thi write wa written.

5:25 and thi is the write that wa written, mene, mene, tekel,
upharsin.

5:26 thi is the interpret of the thing: mene; god hath numbered
thi kingdom, and finish it.

5:27 tekel; thou art weigh in the balances, and art found wanting.

5:28 peres; thi kingdom is divided, and given to the mede and
persians.

5:29 then command belshazzar, and they cloth daniel with scarlet,
and put a chain of gold about hi neck, and made a proclamation
concern him, that he should be the third ruler in the kingdom.

5:30 In that night wa belshazzar the king of the chaldean slain.

5:31 and dariu the median took the kingdom, be about threescore
and two year old.

6:1 It pleas dariu to set over the kingdom an hundr and twenty
princes, which should be over the whole kingdom; 6:2 and over these
thre presidents; of whom daniel wa first: that the princ might
giv account unto them, and the king should have no damage.

6:3 then thi daniel wa prefer abov the presid and princes,
becaus an excel spirit wa in him; and the king thought to set
him over the whole realm.

6:4 then the presid and princ sought to find occas against
daniel concern the kingdom; but they could find none occas nor
fault; forasmuch as he wa faithful, neither wa there ani error or
fault found in him.

6:5 then said these men, We shall not find ani occas against this
daniel, except we find it against him concern the law of hi god.

6:6 then these presid and princ assembl togeth to the king,
and said thu unto him, king darius, live for ever.

6:7 all the presid of the kingdom, the governors, and the princes,
th counsellors, and the captains, have consult togeth to
establish a royal statute, and to make a firm decree, that whosoever
shal ask a petit of ani god or man for thirti days, save of thee,
o king, he shall be cast into the den of lions.

6:8 now, O king, establish the decree, and sign the writing, that it
b not changed, accord to the law of the mede and persians, which
altereth not.

6:9 wherefor king dariu sign the write and the decree.

6:10 now when daniel knew that the write wa signed, he went into
hi house; and hi window be open in hi chamber toward jerusalem,
h kneel upon hi knee three time a day, and prayed, and gave
thank befor hi god, as he did aforetime.
