6:11 then these men assembled, and found daniel pray and making
suppl befor hi god.

6:12 then they came near, and spake befor the king concern the
king' decree; hast thou not sign a decree, that everi man that
shal ask a petit of ani god or man within thirti days, save of
thee, O king, shall be cast into the den of lions? the king answered
and said, the thing is true, accord to the law of the mede and
persians, which altereth not.

6:13 then answer they and said befor the king, that daniel, which
i of the children of the captiv of judah, regardeth not thee, o
king, nor the decre that thou hast signed, but maketh hi petition
thre time a day.

6:14 then the king, when he heard these words, wa sore displeased
with himself, and set hi heart on daniel to deliv him: and he
labour till the go down of the sun to deliv him.

6:15 then these men assembl unto the king, and said unto the king,
know, O king, that the law of the mede and persian is, that no
decre nor statut which the king establisheth may be changed.

6:16 then the king commanded, and they brought daniel, and cast him
into the den of lions. now the king spake and said unto daniel, thy
god whom thou servest continually, he will deliv thee.

6:17 and a stone wa brought, and laid upon the mouth of the den; and
th king seal it with hi own signet, and with the signet of his
lords; that the purpos might not be chang concern daniel.

6:18 then the king went to hi palace, and pass the night fasting:
neith were instrument of musick brought befor him: and hi sleep
went from him.

6:19 then the king aros veri earli in the morning, and went in haste
unto the den of lions.

6:20 and when he came to the den, he cri with a lament voice
unto daniel: and the king spake and said to daniel, O daniel, servant
of the live god, is thi god, whom thou servest continually, abl to
deliv thee from the lions?  6:21 then said daniel unto the king, o
king, live for ever.

6:22 My god hath sent hi angel, and hath shut the lions' mouths, that
they have not hurt me: forasmuch as befor him innoc wa found in
me; and also befor thee, O king, have I done no hurt.

6:23 then wa the king exceedingli glad for him, and command that
they should take daniel up out of the den. So daniel wa taken up out
of the den, and no manner of hurt wa found upon him, becaus he
believ in hi god.

6:24 and the king commanded, and they brought those men which had
accus daniel, and they cast them into the den of lions, them, their
children, and their wives; and the lion had the masteri of them, and
brak all their bone in piec or ever they came at the bottom of the
den.

6:25 then king dariu wrote unto all people, nations, and languages,
that dwell in all the earth; peac be multipli unto you.

6:26 I make a decree, that in everi dominion of my kingdom men tremble
and fear befor the god of daniel: for he is the live god, and
stedfast for ever, and hi kingdom that which shall not be destroyed,
and hi dominion shall be even unto the end.

6:27 He delivereth and rescueth, and he worketh sign and wonder in
heaven and in earth, who hath deliv daniel from the power of the
lions.

6:28 So thi daniel prosper in the reign of darius, and in the reign
of cyru the persian.

7:1 In the first year of belshazzar king of babylon daniel had a dream
and vision of hi head upon hi bed: then he wrote the dream, and
told the sum of the matters.

7:2 daniel spake and said, I saw in my vision by night, and, behold,
th four wind of the heaven strove upon the great sea.

7:3 and four great beast came up from the sea, divers one from
another.

7:4 the first wa like a lion, and had eagle' wings: I beheld till
th wing thereof were plucked, and it wa lift up from the earth,
and made stand upon the feet as a man, and a man' heart wa given to
it.

7:5 and behold anoth beast, a second, like to a bear, and it raised
up itself on one side, and it had three rib in the mouth of it
between the teeth of it: and they said thu unto it, arise, devour
much flesh.

7:6 after thi I beheld, and lo another, like a leopard, which had
upon the back of it four wing of a fowl; the beast had also four
heads; and dominion wa given to it.

7:7 after thi I saw in the night visions, and behold a fourth beast,
dread and terrible, and strong exceedingly; and it had great iron
teeth: it devour and brake in pieces, and stamp the residu with
th feet of it: and it wa divers from all the beast that were
befor it; and it had ten horns.

7:8 I consid the horns, and, behold, there came up among them
anoth littl horn, befor whom there were three of the first horns
pluck up by the roots: and, behold, in thi horn were eye like the
ey of man, and a mouth speak great things.

7:9 I beheld till the throne were cast down, and the ancient of days
did sit, whose garment wa white as snow, and the hair of hi head
lik the pure wool: hi throne wa like the fieri flame, and his
wheel as burn fire.

7:10 A fieri stream issu and came forth from befor him: thousand
thousand minist unto him, and ten thousand time ten thousand
stood befor him: the judgment wa set, and the book were opened.

7:11 I beheld then becaus of the voic of the great word which the
horn spake: I beheld even till the beast wa slain, and hi body
destroyed, and given to the burn flame.

7:12 As concern the rest of the beasts, they had their dominion
taken away: yet their live were prolong for a season and time.

7:13 I saw in the night visions, and, behold, one like the son of man
cam with the cloud of heaven, and came to the ancient of days, and
they brought him near befor him.

7:14 and there wa given him dominion, and glory, and a kingdom, that
al people, nations, and languages, should serv him: hi dominion is
an everlast dominion, which shall not pass away, and hi kingdom
that which shall not be destroyed.

7:15 I daniel wa griev in my spirit in the midst of my body, and
th vision of my head troubl me.

7:16 I came near unto one of them that stood by, and ask him the
truth of all this. So he told me, and made me know the interpretation
of the things.

7:17 these great beasts, which are four, are four kings, which shall
aris out of the earth.

7:18 but the saint of the most high shall take the kingdom, and
possess the kingdom for ever, even for ever and ever.

7:19 then I would know the truth of the fourth beast, which was
divers from all the others, exceed dreadful, whose teeth were of
iron, and hi nail of brass; which devoured, brake in pieces, and
stamp the residu with hi feet; 7:20 and of the ten horn that were
in hi head, and of the other which came up, and befor whom three
fell; even of that horn that had eyes, and a mouth that spake very
great things, whose look wa more stout than hi fellows.

7:21 I beheld, and the same horn made war with the saints, and
prevail against them; 7:22 until the ancient of day came, and
judg wa given to the saint of the most high; and the time came
that the saint possess the kingdom.

7:23 thu he said, the fourth beast shall be the fourth kingdom upon
earth, which shall be divers from all kingdoms, and shall devour the
whol earth, and shall tread it down, and break it in pieces.

7:24 and the ten horn out of thi kingdom are ten king that shall
arise: and anoth shall rise after them; and he shall be divers from
th first, and he shall subdu three kings.

7:25 and he shall speak great word against the most high, and shall
wear out the saint of the most high, and think to chang time and
laws: and they shall be given into hi hand until a time and time and
th divid of time.

7:26 but the judgment shall sit, and they shall take away his
dominion, to consum and to destroy it unto the end.

7:27 and the kingdom and dominion, and the great of the kingdom
und the whole heaven, shall be given to the peopl of the saint of
th most high, whose kingdom is an everlast kingdom, and all
dominion shall serv and obey him.

7:28 hitherto is the end of the matter. As for me daniel, my
cogit much troubl me, and my counten chang in me: but i
kept the matter in my heart.

8:1 In the third year of the reign of king belshazzar a vision
appear unto me, even unto me daniel, after that which appear unto
m at the first.

8:2 and I saw in a vision; and it came to pass, when I saw, that I was
at shushan in the palace, which is in the provinc of elam; and I saw
in a vision, and I wa by the river of ulai.

8:3 then I lift up mine eyes, and saw, and, behold, there stood
befor the river a ram which had two horns: and the two horn were
high; but one wa higher than the other, and the higher came up last.

8:4 I saw the ram push westward, and northward, and southward; so
that no beast might stand befor him, neither wa there ani that
could deliv out of hi hand; but he did accord to hi will, and
becam great.

8:5 and as I wa considering, behold, an he goat came from the west on
th face of the whole earth, and touch not the ground: and the goat
had a notabl horn between hi eyes.

8:6 and he came to the ram that had two horns, which I had seen
stand befor the river, and ran unto him in the furi of hi power.

8:7 and I saw him come close unto the ram, and he wa move with
chol against him, and smote the ram, and brake hi two horns: and
ther wa no power in the ram to stand befor him, but he cast him
down to the ground, and stamp upon him: and there wa none that
could deliv the ram out of hi hand.

8:8 therefor the he goat wax veri great: and when he wa strong,
th great horn wa broken; and for it came up four notabl one toward
th four wind of heaven.

8:9 and out of one of them came forth a littl horn, which waxed
exceed great, toward the south, and toward the east, and toward the
pleas land.

8:10 and it wax great, even to the host of heaven; and it cast down
som of the host and of the star to the ground, and stamp upon
them.

8:11 yea, he magnifi himself even to the princ of the host, and by
him the daili sacrific wa taken away, and the place of the sanctuary
wa cast down.

8:12 and an host wa given him against the daili sacrific by reason
of transgression, and it cast down the truth to the ground; and it
practised, and prospered.

8:13 then I heard one saint speaking, and anoth saint said unto that
certain saint which spake, how long shall be the vision concern the
daili sacrifice, and the transgress of desolation, to give both the
sanctuari and the host to be trodden under foot?  8:14 and he said
unto me, unto two thousand and three hundr days; then shall the
sanctuari be cleansed.

8:15 and it came to pass, when I, even I daniel, had seen the vision,
and sought for the meaning, then, behold, there stood befor me as the
appear of a man.

8:16 and I heard a man' voic between the bank of ulai, which
called, and said, gabriel, make thi man to understand the vision.

8:17 So he came near where I stood: and when he came, I wa afraid,
and fell upon my face: but he said unto me, understand, O son of man:
for at the time of the end shall be the vision.

8:18 now as he wa speak with me, I wa in a deep sleep on my face
toward the ground: but he touch me, and set me upright.

8:19 and he said, behold, I will make thee know what shall be in the
last end of the indignation: for at the time appoint the end shall
be.

8:20 the ram which thou sawest have two horn are the king of media
and persia.

8:21 and the rough goat is the king of grecia: and the great horn that
i between hi eye is the first king.

8:22 now that be broken, wherea four stood up for it, four
kingdom shall stand up out of the nation, but not in hi power.

8:23 and in the latter time of their kingdom, when the transgressors
ar come to the full, a king of fierc countenance, and understanding
dark sentences, shall stand up.

8:24 and hi power shall be mighty, but not by hi own power: and he
shal destroy wonderfully, and shall prosper, and practise, and shall
destroy the mighti and the holi people.

8:25 and through hi polici also he shall caus craft to prosper in
hi hand; and he shall magnifi himself in hi heart, and by peace
shal destroy many: he shall also stand up against the princ of
princes; but he shall be broken without hand.

8:26 and the vision of the even and the morn which wa told is
true: wherefor shut thou up the vision; for it shall be for many
days.

8:27 and I daniel fainted, and wa sick certain days; afterward I rose
up, and did the king' business; and I wa astonish at the vision,
but none understood it.

9:1 In the first year of dariu the son of ahasuerus, of the seed of
th medes, which wa made king over the realm of the chaldeans; 9:2 in
th first year of hi reign I daniel understood by book the number of
th years, whereof the word of the lord came to jeremiah the prophet,
that he would accomplish seventi year in the desol of
jerusalem.

9:3 and I set my face unto the lord god, to seek by prayer and
supplications, with fasting, and sackcloth, and ashes: 9:4 and i
pray unto the lord my god, and made my confession, and said, O lord,
th great and dread god, keep the coven and merci to them
that love him, and to them that keep hi commandments; 9:5 We have
sinned, and have commit iniquity, and have done wickedly, and have
rebelled, even by depart from thi precept and from thi judgments:
9:6 neither have we hearken unto thi servant the prophets, which
spak in thi name to our kings, our princes, and our fathers, and to
al the peopl of the land.

9:7 O lord, righteous belongeth unto thee, but unto us confusion
of faces, as at thi day; to the men of judah, and to the inhabitants
of jerusalem, and unto all israel, that are near, and that are far
off, through all the countri whither thou hast driven them, because
of their trespass that they have trespass against thee.

9:8 O lord, to us belongeth confus of face, to our kings, to our
princes, and to our fathers, becaus we have sin against thee.

9:9 To the lord our god belong merci and forgivenesses, though we
hav rebel against him; 9:10 neither have we obey the voic of
th lord our god, to walk in hi laws, which he set befor us by his
serv the prophets.

9:11 yea, all israel have transgress thi law, even by departing,
that they might not obey thi voice; therefor the curs is pour upon
us, and the oath that is written in the law of mose the servant of
god, becaus we have sin against him.

9:12 and he hath confirm hi words, which he spake against us, and
against our judg that judg us, by bring upon us a great evil:
for under the whole heaven hath not been done as hath been done upon
jerusalem.

9:13 As it is written in the law of moses, all thi evil is come upon
us: yet made we not our prayer befor the lord our god, that we might
turn from our iniquities, and understand thi truth.

9:14 therefor hath the lord watch upon the evil, and brought it
upon us: for the lord our god is righteou in all hi work which he
doeth: for we obey not hi voice.

9:15 and now, O lord our god, that hast brought thi peopl forth out
of the land of egypt with a mighti hand, and hast gotten thee renown,
a at thi day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly.

9:16 O lord, accord to all thi righteousness, I beseech thee, let
thin anger and thi furi be turn away from thi citi jerusalem, thy
holi mountain: becaus for our sins, and for the iniqu of our
fathers, jerusalem and thi peopl are becom a reproach to all that
ar about us.

9:17 now therefore, O our god, hear the prayer of thi servant, and his
supplications, and caus thi face to shine upon thi sanctuari that is
desolate, for the lord' sake.

9:18 O my god, inclin thine ear, and hear; open thine eyes, and
behold our desolations, and the citi which is call by thi name: for
w do not present our supplic befor thee for our
righteousnesses, but for thi great mercies.

9:19 O lord, hear; O lord, forgive; O lord, hearken and do; defer not,
for thine own sake, O my god: for thi citi and thi peopl are called
bi thi name.

9:20 and while I wa speaking, and praying, and confess my sin and
th sin of my peopl israel, and present my supplic befor the
lord my god for the holi mountain of my god; 9:21 yea, while I was
speak in prayer, even the man gabriel, whom I had seen in the
vis at the beginning, be caus to fli swiftly, touch me about
th time of the even oblation.

9:22 and he inform me, and talk with me, and said, O daniel, I am
now come forth to give thee skill and understanding.

9:23 At the begin of thi supplic the command came forth,
and I am come to shew thee; for thou art greatli beloved: therefore
understand the matter, and consid the vision.

9:24 seventi week are determin upon thi peopl and upon thi holy
city, to finish the transgression, and to make an end of sins, and to
mak reconcili for iniquity, and to bring in everlasting
righteousness, and to seal up the vision and prophecy, and to anoint
th most holy.

9:25 know therefor and understand, that from the go forth of the
command to restor and to build jerusalem unto the messiah the
princ shall be seven weeks, and threescor and two weeks: the street
shal be built again, and the wall, even in troublou times.

9:26 and after threescor and two week shall messiah be cut off, but
not for himself: and the peopl of the princ that shall come shall
destroy the citi and the sanctuary; and the end thereof shall be with
a flood, and unto the end of the war desol are determined.

9:27 and he shall confirm the coven with mani for one week: and in
th midst of the week he shall caus the sacrific and the oblat to
cease, and for the overspread of abomin he shall make it
desolate, even until the consummation, and that determin shall be
pour upon the desolate.

10:1 In the third year of cyru king of persia a thing wa revealed
unto daniel, whose name wa call belteshazzar; and the thing was
true, but the time appoint wa long: and he understood the thing,
and had understand of the vision.

10:2 In those day I daniel wa mourn three full weeks.

10:3 I ate no pleasant bread, neither came flesh nor wine in my mouth,
neith did I anoint myself at all, till three whole week were
fulfilled.

10:4 and in the four and twentieth day of the first month, as I wa by
th side of the great river, which is hiddekel; 10:5 then I lift up
min eyes, and looked, and behold a certain man cloth in linen,
whos loin were gird with fine gold of uphaz: 10:6 hi bodi also
wa like the beryl, and hi face as the appear of lightning, and
hi eye as lamp of fire, and hi arm and hi feet like in colour to
polish brass, and the voic of hi word like the voic of a
multitude.

10:7 and I daniel alon saw the vision: for the men that were with me
saw not the vision; but a great quak fell upon them, so that they
fl to hide themselves.

10:8 therefor I wa left alone, and saw thi great vision, and there
remain no strength in me: for my comeli wa turn in me into
corruption, and I retain no strength.

10:9 yet heard I the voic of hi words: and when I heard the voic of
hi words, then wa I in a deep sleep on my face, and my face toward
th ground.

10:10 and, behold, an hand touch me, which set me upon my knee and
upon the palm of my hands.

10:11 and he said unto me, O daniel, a man greatli beloved, understand
th word that I speak unto thee, and stand upright: for unto thee am
i now sent.

and when he had spoken thi word unto me, I stood trembling.

10:12 then said he unto me, fear not, daniel: for from the first day
that thou didst set thine heart to understand, and to chasten thyself
befor thi god, thi word were heard, and I am come for thi words.

10:13 but the princ of the kingdom of persia withstood me one and
twenti days: but, lo, michael, one of the chief princes, came to help
me; and I remain there with the king of persia.

10:14 now I am come to make thee understand what shall befal thy
peopl in the latter days: for yet the vision is for mani days.

10:15 and when he had spoken such word unto me, I set my face toward
th ground, and I becam dumb.

10:16 and, behold, one like the similitud of the son of men touched
mi lips: then I open my mouth, and spake, and said unto him that
stood befor me, O my lord, by the vision my sorrow are turn upon
me, and I have retain no strength.

10:17 for how can the servant of thi my lord talk with thi my lord?
for as for me, straightway there remain no strength in me, neither
i there breath left in me.

10:18 then there came again and touch me one like the appear of
a man, and he strengthen me, 10:19 and said, O man greatli beloved,
fear not: peac be unto thee, be strong, yea, be strong. and when he
had spoken unto me, I wa strengthened, and said, let my lord speak;
for thou hast strengthen me.

10:20 then said he, knowest thou wherefor I come unto thee? and now
wil I return to fight with the princ of persia: and when I am gone
forth, lo, the princ of grecia shall come.

10:21 but I will shew thee that which is note in the scriptur of
truth: and there is none that holdeth with me in these things, but
michael your prince.

11:1 also I in the first year of dariu the mede, even I, stood to
confirm and to strengthen him.

11:2 and now will I shew thee the truth. behold, there shall stand up
yet three king in persia; and the fourth shall be far richer than
they all: and by hi strength through hi rich he shall stir up all
against the realm of grecia.

11:3 and a mighti king shall stand up, that shall rule with great
dominion, and do accord to hi will.

11:4 and when he shall stand up, hi kingdom shall be broken, and
shal be divid toward the four wind of heaven; and not to his
posterity, nor accord to hi dominion which he ruled: for his
kingdom shall be pluck up, even for other besid those.

11:5 and the king of the south shall be strong, and one of his
princes; and he shall be strong abov him, and have dominion; his
dominion shall be a great dominion.

11:6 and in the end of year they shall join themselv together; for
th king' daughter of the south shall come to the king of the north
to make an agreement: but she shall not retain the power of the arm;
neith shall he stand, nor hi arm: but she shall be given up, and
they that brought her, and he that begat her, and he that strengthened
h in these times.

11:7 but out of a branch of her root shall one stand up in his
estate, which shall come with an army, and shall enter into the
fortress of the king of the north, and shall deal against them, and
shal prevail: 11:8 and shall also carri captiv into egypt their
gods, with their princes, and with their preciou vessel of silver
and of gold; and he shall continu more year than the king of the
north.

11:9 So the king of the south shall come into hi kingdom, and shall
return into hi own land.

11:10 but hi son shall be stir up, and shall assembl a multitude
of great forces: and one shall certainli come, and overflow, and pass
through: then shall he return, and be stir up, even to his
fortress.

11:11 and the king of the south shall be move with choler, and shall
com forth and fight with him, even with the king of the north: and he
shal set forth a great multitude; but the multitud shall be given
into hi hand.

11:12 and when he hath taken away the multitude, hi heart shall be
lift up; and he shall cast down mani ten thousands: but he shall not
b strengthen by it.

11:13 for the king of the north shall return, and shall set forth a
multitud greater than the former, and shall certainli come after
certain year with a great armi and with much riches.

11:14 and in those time there shall mani stand up against the king of
th south: also the robber of thi peopl shall exalt themselv to
establish the vision; but they shall fall.

11:15 So the king of the north shall come, and cast up a mount, and
tak the most fenc cities: and the arm of the south shall not
withstand, neither hi chosen people, neither shall there be any
strength to withstand.

11:16 but he that cometh against him shall do accord to hi own
will, and none shall stand befor him: and he shall stand in the
glori land, which by hi hand shall be consumed.

11:17 He shall also set hi face to enter with the strength of his
whol kingdom, and upright one with him; thu shall he do: and he
shal give him the daughter of women, corrupt her: but she shall
not stand on hi side, neither be for him.

11:18 after thi shall he turn hi face unto the isles, and shall take
many: but a princ for hi own behalf shall caus the reproach offered
bi him to cease; without hi own reproach he shall caus it to turn
upon him.

11:19 then he shall turn hi face toward the fort of hi own land: but
h shall stumbl and fall, and not be found.

11:20 then shall stand up in hi estat a raiser of tax in the glory
of the kingdom: but within few day he shall be destroyed, neither in
anger, nor in battle.

11:21 and in hi estat shall stand up a vile person, to whom they
shal not give the honour of the kingdom: but he shall come in
peaceably, and obtain the kingdom by flatteries.

11:22 and with the arm of a flood shall they be overflown from before
him, and shall be broken; yea, also the princ of the covenant.

11:23 and after the leagu made with him he shall work deceitfully:
for he shall come up, and shall becom strong with a small people.

11:24 He shall enter peaceabl even upon the fattest place of the
province; and he shall do that which hi father have not done, nor
hi fathers' fathers; he shall scatter among them the prey, and spoil,
and riches: yea, and he shall forecast hi devic against the strong
holds, even for a time.

11:25 and he shall stir up hi power and hi courag against the king
of the south with a great army; and the king of the south shall be
stir up to battl with a veri great and mighti army; but he shall
not stand: for they shall forecast devic against him.

11:26 yea, they that feed of the portion of hi meat shall destroy
him, and hi armi shall overflow: and mani shall fall down slain.

11:27 and both of these kings' heart shall be to do mischief, and
they shall speak lie at one table; but it shall not prosper: for yet
th end shall be at the time appointed.

11:28 then shall he return into hi land with great riches; and his
heart shall be against the holi covenant; and he shall do exploits,
and return to hi own land.

11:29 At the time appoint he shall return, and come toward the
south; but it shall not be as the former, or as the latter.

11:30 for the ship of chittim shall come against him: therefor he
shal be grieved, and return, and have indign against the holy
covenant: so shall he do; he shall even return, and have intelligence
with them that forsak the holi covenant.

11:31 and arm shall stand on hi part, and they shall pollut the
sanctuari of strength, and shall take away the daili sacrifice, and
they shall place the abomin that maketh desolate.

11:32 and such as do wickedli against the coven shall he corrupt by
flatteries: but the peopl that do know their god shall be strong, and
do exploits.

11:33 and they that understand among the peopl shall instruct many:
yet they shall fall by the sword, and by flame, by captivity, and by
spoil, mani days.

11:34 now when they shall fall, they shall be holpen with a little
help: but mani shall cleav to them with flatteries.

11:35 and some of them of understand shall fall, to tri them, and
to purge, and to make them white, even to the time of the end: because
it is yet for a time appointed.

11:36 and the king shall do accord to hi will; and he shall exalt
himself, and magnifi himself abov everi god, and shall speak
marvel thing against the god of gods, and shall prosper till the
indign be accomplished: for that that is determin shall be
done.

11:37 neither shall he regard the god of hi fathers, nor the desire
of women, nor regard ani god: for he shall magnifi himself abov all.

11:38 but in hi estat shall he honour the god of forces: and a god
whom hi father knew not shall he honour with gold, and silver, and
with preciou stones, and pleasant things.

11:39 thu shall he do in the most strong hold with a strang god,
whom he shall acknowledg and increas with glory: and he shall cause
them to rule over many, and shall divid the land for gain.

11:40 and at the time of the end shall the king of the south push at
him: and the king of the north shall come against him like a
whirlwind, with chariots, and with horsemen, and with mani ships; and
h shall enter into the countries, and shall overflow and pass over.

11:41 He shall enter also into the gloriou land, and mani countries
shal be overthrown: but these shall escap out of hi hand, even
edom, and moab, and the chief of the children of ammon.

11:42 He shall stretch forth hi hand also upon the countries: and the
land of egypt shall not escape.

11:43 but he shall have power over the treasur of gold and of
silver, and over all the preciou thing of egypt: and the libyan and
th ethiopian shall be at hi steps.

11:44 but tide out of the east and out of the north shall trouble
him: therefor he shall go forth with great furi to destroy, and
utterli to make away many.

11:45 and he shall plant the tabernacl of hi palac between the
sea in the gloriou holi mountain; yet he shall come to hi end, and
non shall help him.

12:1 and at that time shall michael stand up, the great princ which
standeth for the children of thi people: and there shall be a time of
trouble, such as never wa sinc there wa a nation even to that same
time: and at that time thi peopl shall be delivered, everi one that
shal be found written in the book.

12:2 and mani of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake,
som to everlast life, and some to shame and everlast contempt.

12:3 and they that be wise shall shine as the bright of the
firmament; and they that turn mani to righteous as the star for
ev and ever.

12:4 but thou, O daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, even to
th time of the end: mani shall run to and fro, and knowledg shall be
increased.

12:5 then I daniel looked, and, behold, there stood other two, the one
on thi side of the bank of the river, and the other on that side of
th bank of the river.

12:6 and one said to the man cloth in linen, which wa upon the
wat of the river, how long shall it be to the end of these wonders?
12:7 and I heard the man cloth in linen, which wa upon the waters
of the river, when he held up hi right hand and hi left hand unto
heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that it shall be for a
time, times, and an half; and when he shall have accomplish to
scatt the power of the holi people, all these thing shall be
finished.

12:8 and I heard, but I understood not: then said I, O my lord, what
shal be the end of these things?  12:9 and he said, Go thi way,
daniel: for the word are close up and seal till the time of the
end.

12:10 mani shall be purified, and made white, and tried; but the
wick shall do wickedly: and none of the wick shall understand; but
th wise shall understand.

12:11 and from the time that the daili sacrific shall be taken away,
and the abomin that maketh desol set up, there shall be a
thousand two hundr and nineti days.

12:12 bless is he that waiteth, and cometh to the thousand three
hundr and five and thirti days.

12:13 but go thou thi way till the end be: for thou shalt rest,
and stand in thi lot at the end of the days.




hosea


1:1 the word of the lord that came unto hosea, the son of beeri, in
th day of uzziah, jotham, ahaz, and hezekiah, king of judah, and in
th day of jeroboam the son of joash, king of israel.

1:2 the begin of the word of the lord by hosea. and the lord said
to hosea, go, take unto thee a wife of whoredom and children of
whoredoms: for the land hath commit great whoredom, depart from
th lord.

1:3 So he went and took gomer the daughter of diblaim; which
conceived, and bare him a son.

1:4 and the lord said unto him, call hi name jezreel; for yet a
littl while, and I will aveng the blood of jezreel upon the hous of
jehu, and will caus to ceas the kingdom of the hous of israel.

1:5 and it shall come to pass at that day, that I will break the bow
of israel, in the valley of jezreel.

1:6 and she conceiv again, and bare a daughter. and god said unto
him, call her name loruhamah: for I will no more have merci upon the
hous of israel; but I will utterli take them away.

1:7 but I will have merci upon the hous of judah, and will save them
bi the lord their god, and will not save them by bow, nor by sword,
nor by battle, by horses, nor by horsemen.

1:8 now when she had wean loruhamah, she conceived, and bare a son.

1:9 then said god, call hi name loammi: for ye are not my people, and
i will not be your god.

1:10 yet the number of the children of israel shall be as the sand of
th sea, which cannot be measur nor numbered; and it shall come to
pass, that in the place where it wa said unto them, Ye are not my
people, there it shall be said unto them, Ye are the son of the
liv god.

1:11 then shall the children of judah and the children of israel be
gath together, and appoint themselv one head, and they shall
com up out of the land: for great shall be the day of jezreel.

2:1 say ye unto your brethren, ammi; and to your sisters, ruhamah.

2:2 plead with your mother, plead: for she is not my wife, neither am
i her husband: let her therefor put away her whoredom out of her
sight, and her adulteri from between her breasts; 2:3 lest I strip
her naked, and set her as in the day that she wa born, and make her
a a wilderness, and set her like a dri land, and slay her with
thirst.

2:4 and I will not have merci upon her children; for they be the
children of whoredoms.

2:5 for their mother hath play the harlot: she that conceiv them
hath done shamefully: for she said, I will go after my lovers, that
giv me my bread and my water, my wool and my flax, mine oil and my
drink.

2:6 therefore, behold, I will hedg up thi way with thorns, and make a
wall, that she shall not find her paths.

2:7 and she shall follow after her lovers, but she shall not overtake
them; and she shall seek them, but shall not find them: then shall she
say, I will go and return to my first husband; for then wa it better
with me than now.

2:8 for she did not know that I gave her corn, and wine, and oil, and
multipli her silver and gold, which they prepar for baal.

2:9 therefor will I return, and take away my corn in the time
thereof, and my wine in the season thereof, and will recov my wool
and my flax given to cover her nakedness.

2:10 and now will I discov her lewd in the sight of her lovers,
and none shall deliv her out of mine hand.

2:11 I will also caus all her mirth to cease, her feast days, her new
moons, and her sabbaths, and all her solemn feasts.

2:12 and I will destroy her vine and her fig trees, whereof she hath
said, these are my reward that my lover have given me: and I will
mak them a forest, and the beast of the field shall eat them.

2:13 and I will visit upon her the day of baalim, wherein she burned
incens to them, and she deck herself with her ear and her
jewels, and she went after her lovers, and forgat me, saith the lord.

2:14 therefore, behold, I will allur her, and bring her into the
wilderness, and speak comfort unto her.

2:15 and I will give her her vineyard from thence, and the valley of
achor for a door of hope: and she shall sing there, as in the day of
her youth, and as in the day when she came up out of the land of
egypt.

2:16 and it shall be at that day, saith the lord, that thou shalt call
m ishi; and shalt call me no more baali.

2:17 for I will take away the name of baalim out of her mouth, and
they shall no more be rememb by their name.

2:18 and in that day will I make a coven for them with the beasts
of the field and with the fowl of heaven, and with the creeping
th of the ground: and I will break the bow and the sword and the
battl out of the earth, and will make them to lie down safely.

2:19 and I will betroth thee unto me for ever; yea, I will betroth
the unto me in righteousness, and in judgment, and in lovingkindness,
and in mercies.

2:20 I will even betroth thee unto me in faithfulness: and thou shalt
know the lord.

2:21 and it shall come to pass in that day, I will hear, saith the
lord, I will hear the heavens, and they shall hear the earth; 2:22 and
th earth shall hear the corn, and the wine, and the oil; and they
shal hear jezreel.

2:23 and I will sow her unto me in the earth; and I will have mercy
upon her that had not obtain mercy; and I will say to them which
wer not my people, thou art my people; and they shall say, thou art
mi god.

3:1 then said the lord unto me, Go yet, love a woman belov of her
friend, yet an adulteress, accord to the love of the lord toward
th children of israel, who look to other gods, and love flagon of
wine.

3:2 So I bought her to me for fifteen piec of silver, and for an
hom of barley, and an half homer of barley: 3:3 and I said unto her,
thou shalt abid for me mani days; thou shalt not play the harlot, and
thou shalt not be for anoth man: so will I also be for thee.

3:4 for the children of israel shall abid mani day without a king,
and without a prince, and without a sacrifice, and without an image,
and without an ephod, and without teraphim: 3:5 afterward shall the
children of israel return, and seek the lord their god, and david
their king; and shall fear the lord and hi good in the latter
days.

4:1 hear the word of the lord, ye children of israel: for the lord
hath a controversi with the inhabit of the land, becaus there is
no truth, nor mercy, nor knowledg of god in the land.

4:2 By swearing, and lying, and killing, and stealing, and committing
adultery, they break out, and blood toucheth blood.

4:3 therefor shall the land mourn, and everi one that dwelleth
therein shall languish, with the beast of the field, and with the
fowl of heaven; yea, the fish of the sea also shall be taken away.

4:4 yet let no man strive, nor reprov another: for thi peopl are as
they that strive with the priest.

4:5 therefor shalt thou fall in the day, and the prophet also shall
fal with thee in the night, and I will destroy thi mother.

4:6 My peopl are destroy for lack of knowledge: becaus thou hast
reject knowledge, I will also reject thee, that thou shalt be no
priest to me: see thou hast forgotten the law of thi god, I will
also forget thi children.

4:7 As they were increased, so they sin against me: therefor will
i chang their glori into shame.

4:8 they eat up the sin of my people, and they set their heart on
their iniquity.

4:9 and there shall be, like people, like priest: and I will punish
them for their ways, and reward them their doings.

4:10 for they shall eat, and not have enough: they shall commit
whoredom, and shall not increase: becaus they have left off to take
he to the lord.

4:11 whoredom and wine and new wine take away the heart.

4:12 My peopl ask counsel at their stocks, and their staff declareth
unto them: for the spirit of whoredom hath caus them to err, and
they have gone a whore from under their god.

4:13 they sacrific upon the top of the mountains, and burn incense
upon the hills, under oak and poplar and elms, becaus the shadow
thereof is good: therefor your daughter shall commit whoredom, and
your spous shall commit adultery.

4:14 I will not punish your daughter when they commit whoredom, nor
your spous when they commit adultery: for themselv are separated
with whores, and they sacrific with harlots: therefor the people
that doth not understand shall fall.

4:15 though thou, israel, play the harlot, yet let not judah offend;
and come not ye unto gilgal, neither go ye up to bethaven, nor swear,
th lord liveth.

4:16 for israel slideth back as a backslid heifer: now the lord
wil feed them as a lamb in a larg place.

4:17 ephraim is join to idols: let him alone.

4:18 their drink is sour: they have commit whoredom continually:
h ruler with shame do love, give ye.

4:19 the wind hath bound her up in her wings, and they shall be
asham becaus of their sacrifices.

5:1 hear ye this, O priests; and hearken, ye hous of israel; and give
y ear, O hous of the king; for judgment is toward you, becaus ye
hav been a snare on mizpah, and a net spread upon tabor.

5:2 and the revolt are profound to make slaughter, though I have
been a rebuk of them all.

5:3 I know ephraim, and israel is not hid from me: for now, O ephraim,
th committest whoredom, and israel is defiled.

5:4 they will not frame their do to turn unto their god: for the
spirit of whoredom is in the midst of them, and they have not known
th lord.

5:5 and the pride of israel doth testifi to hi face: therefor shall
israel and ephraim fall in their iniquity: judah also shall fall with
them.

5:6 they shall go with their flock and with their herd to seek the
lord; but they shall not find him; he hath withdrawn himself from
them.

5:7 they have dealt treacher against the lord: for they have
begotten strang children: now shall a month devour them with their
portions.

5:8 blow ye the cornet in gibeah, and the trumpet in ramah: cri aloud
at bethaven, after thee, O benjamin.

5:9 ephraim shall be desol in the day of rebuke: among the tribes
of israel have I made known that which shall sure be.

5:10 the princ of judah were like them that remov the bound:
therefor I will pour out my wrath upon them like water.

5:11 ephraim is oppress and broken in judgment, becaus he willingly
walk after the commandment.

5:12 therefor will I be unto ephraim as a moth, and to the hous of
judah as rottenness.

5:13 when ephraim saw hi sickness, and judah saw hi wound, then went
ephraim to the assyrian, and sent to king jareb: yet could he not heal
you, nor cure you of your wound.

5:14 for I will be unto ephraim as a lion, and as a young lion to the
hous of judah: I, even I, will tear and go away; I will take away,
and none shall rescu him.

5:15 I will go and return to my place, till they acknowledg their
offence, and seek my face: in their afflict they will seek me
early.

6:1 come, and let us return unto the lord: for he hath torn, and he
wil heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.

6:2 after two day will he reviv us: in the third day he will raise
u up, and we shall live in hi sight.

6:3 then shall we know, if we follow on to know the lord: hi going
forth is prepar as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the
rain, as the latter and former rain unto the earth.

6:4 O ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O judah, what shall I do
unto thee? for your good is as a morn cloud, and as the early
dew it goeth away.

6:5 therefor have I hew them by the prophets; I have slain them by
th word of my mouth: and thi judgment are as the light that goeth
forth.

6:6 for I desir mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledg of god
mor than burnt offerings.

6:7 but they like men have transgress the covenant: there have they
dealt treacher against me.

6:8 gilead is a citi of them that work iniquity, and is pollut with
blood.

6:9 and as troop of robber wait for a man, so the compani of priests
murd in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.

6:10 I have seen an horribl thing in the hous of israel: there is
th whoredom of ephraim, israel is defiled.

6:11 also, O judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned
th captiv of my people.

7:1 when I would have heal israel, then the iniqu of ephraim was
discovered, and the wicked of samaria: for they commit falsehood;
and the thief cometh in, and the troop of robber spoileth without.

7:2 and they consid not in their heart that I rememb all their
wickedness: now their own do have beset them about; they are
befor my face.

7:3 they make the king glad with their wickedness, and the princes
with their lies.

7:4 they are all adulterers, as an oven heat by the baker, who
ceaseth from rais after he hath knead the dough, until it be
leavened.

7:5 In the day of our king the princ have made him sick with bottles
of wine; he stretch out hi hand with scorners.

7:6 for they have made readi their heart like an oven, while they lie
in wait: their baker sleepeth all the night; in the morn it burneth
a a flame fire.

7:7 they are all hot as an oven, and have devour their judges; all
their king are fallen: there is none among them that calleth unto me.

7:8 ephraim, he hath mix himself among the people; ephraim is a cake
not turned.

7:9 stranger have devour hi strength, and he knoweth it not: yea,
gray hair are here and there upon him, yet he knoweth not.

7:10 and the pride of israel testifieth to hi face: and they do not
return to the lord their god, nor seek him for all this.

7:11 ephraim also is like a silli dove without heart: they call to
egypt, they go to assyria.

7:12 when they shall go, I will spread my net upon them; I will bring
them down as the fowl of the heaven; I will chastis them, as their
congreg hath heard.

7:13 woe unto them! for they have fled from me: destruct unto them!
becaus they have transgress against me: though I have redeemed
them, yet they have spoken lie against me.

7:14 and they have not cri unto me with their heart, when they
howl upon their beds: they assembl themselv for corn and wine,
and they rebel against me.

7:15 though I have bound and strengthen their arms, yet do they
imagin mischief against me.

7:16 they return, but not to the most high: they are like a deceitful
bow: their princ shall fall by the sword for the rage of their
tongue: thi shall be their deris in the land of egypt.

8:1 set the trumpet to thi mouth. He shall come as an eagl against
th hous of the lord, becaus they have transgress my covenant, and
trespass against my law.

8:2 israel shall cri unto me, My god, we know thee.

8:3 israel hath cast off the thing that is good: the enemi shall
pursu him.

8:4 they have set up kings, but not by me: they have made princes, and
i knew it not: of their silver and their gold have they made them
idols, that they may be cut off.

8:5 thi calf, O samaria, hath cast thee off; mine anger is kindled
against them: how long will it be ere they attain to innocency?  8:6
for from israel wa it also: the workman made it; therefor it is not
god: but the calf of samaria shall be broken in pieces.

8:7 for they have sown the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: it
hath no stalk; the bud shall yield no meal: if so be it yield, the
strang shall swallow it up.

8:8 israel is swallow up: now shall they be among the gentil as a
vessel wherein is no pleasure.

8:9 for they are gone up to assyria, a wild ass alon by himself:
ephraim hath hire lovers.

8:10 yea, though they have hire among the nations, now will I gather
them, and they shall sorrow a littl for the burden of the king of
princes.

8:11 becaus ephraim hath made mani altar to sin, altar shall be
unto him to sin.

8:12 I have written to him the great thing of my law, but they were
count as a strang thing.

8:13 they sacrific flesh for the sacrific of mine offerings, and
eat it; but the lord accepteth them not; now will he rememb their
iniquity, and visit their sins: they shall return to egypt.

8:14 for israel hath forgotten hi maker, and buildeth temples; and
judah hath multipli fenc cities: but I will send a fire upon his
cities, and it shall devour the palac thereof.

9:1 rejoic not, O israel, for joy, as other people: for thou hast
gon a whore from thi god, thou hast love a reward upon every
cornfloor.

9:2 the floor and the winepress shall not feed them, and the new wine
shal fail in her.

9:3 they shall not dwell in the lord' land; but ephraim shall return
to egypt, and they shall eat unclean thing in assyria.

9:4 they shall not offer wine offer to the lord, neither shall
they be pleas unto him: their sacrific shall be unto them as the
bread of mourners; all that eat thereof shall be polluted: for their
bread for their soul shall not come into the hous of the lord.

9:5 what will ye do in the solemn day, and in the day of the feast of
th lord?  9:6 for, lo, they are gone becaus of destruction: egypt
shal gather them up, memphi shall buri them: the pleasant place for
their silver, nettl shall possess them: thorn shall be in their
tabernacles.

9:7 the day of visit are come, the day of recomp are come;
israel shall know it: the prophet is a fool, the spiritu man is mad,
for the multitud of thine iniquity, and the great hatred.

9:8 the watchman of ephraim wa with my god: but the prophet is a
snar of a fowler in all hi ways, and hatr in the hous of hi god.

9:9 they have deepli corrupt themselves, as in the day of gibeah:
therefor he will rememb their iniquity, he will visit their sins.

9:10 I found israel like grape in the wilderness; I saw your fathers
a the firstrip in the fig tree at her first time: but they went to
baalpeor, and separ themselv unto that shame; and their
abomin were accord as they loved.

9:11 As for ephraim, their glori shall fli away like a bird, from the
birth, and from the womb, and from the conception.

9:12 though they bring up their children, yet will I bereav them,
that there shall not be a man left: yea, woe also to them when i
depart from them!  9:13 ephraim, as I saw tyrus, is plant in a
pleas place: but ephraim shall bring forth hi children to the
murderer.

9:14 give them, O lord: what wilt thou give? give them a miscarrying
womb and dri breasts.

9:15 all their wicked is in gilgal: for there I hate them: for
th wicked of their do I will drive them out of mine house, i
wil love them no more: all their princ are revolters.

9:16 ephraim is smitten, their root is dri up, they shall bear no
fruit: yea, though they bring forth, yet will I slay even the beloved
fruit of their womb.

9:17 My god will cast them away, becaus they did not hearken unto
him: and they shall be wander among the nations.

10:1 israel is an empti vine, he bringeth forth fruit unto himself:
accord to the multitud of hi fruit he hath increas the altars;
accord to the good of hi land they have made goodli images.

10:2 their heart is divided; now shall they be found faulty: he shall
break down their altars, he shall spoil their images.

10:3 for now they shall say, We have no king, becaus we fear not
th lord; what then should a king do to us?  10:4 they have spoken
words, swear fals in make a covenant: thu judgment springeth
up as hemlock in the furrow of the field.

10:5 the inhabit of samaria shall fear becaus of the calv of
bethaven: for the peopl thereof shall mourn over it, and the priests
thereof that rejoic on it, for the glori thereof, becaus it is
depart from it.

10:6 It shall be also carri unto assyria for a present to king
jareb: ephraim shall receiv shame, and israel shall be asham of his
own counsel.

10:7 As for samaria, her king is cut off as the foam upon the water.

10:8 the high place also of aven, the sin of israel, shall be
destroyed: the thorn and the thistl shall come up on their altars;
and they shall say to the mountains, cover us; and to the hills, fall
on us.

10:9 O israel, thou hast sin from the day of gibeah: there they
stood: the battl in gibeah against the children of iniqu did not
overtak them.

10:10 It is in my desir that I should chastis them; and the people
shal be gather against them, when they shall bind themselv in
their two furrows.

10:11 and ephraim is as an heifer that is taught, and loveth to tread
out the corn; but I pass over upon her fair neck: I will make
ephraim to ride; judah shall plow, and jacob shall break hi clods.

10:12 sow to yourselv in righteousness, reap in mercy; break up your
fallow ground: for it is time to seek the lord, till he come and rain
right upon you.

10:13 Ye have plow wickedness, ye have reap iniquity; ye have
eaten the fruit of lies: becaus thou didst trust in thi way, in the
multitud of thi mighti men.

10:14 therefor shall a tumult aris among thi people, and all thy
fortress shall be spoiled, as shalman spoil betharbel in the day
of battle: the mother wa dash in piec upon her children.

10:15 So shall bethel do unto you becaus of your great wickedness: in
a morn shall the king of israel utterli be cut off.

11:1 when israel wa a child, then I love him, and call my son out
of egypt.

11:2 As they call them, so they went from them: they sacrif unto
baalim, and burn incens to graven images.

11:3 I taught ephraim also to go, take them by their arms; but they
knew not that I heal them.

11:4 I drew them with cord of a man, with band of love: and I wa to
them as they that take off the yoke on their jaws, and I laid meat
unto them.

11:5 He shall not return into the land of egypt, and the assyrian
shal be hi king, becaus they refus to return.

11:6 and the sword shall abid on hi cities, and shall consum his
branches, and devour them, becaus of their own counsels.

11:7 and my peopl are bent to backslid from me: though they called
them to the most high, none at all would exalt him.

11:8 how shall I give thee up, ephraim? how shall I deliv thee,
israel?  how shall I make thee as admah? how shall I set thee as
zeboim? mine heart is turn within me, my repent are kindled
together.

11:9 I will not execut the fierc of mine anger, I will not
return to destroy ephraim: for I am god, and not man; the holi one in
th midst of thee: and I will not enter into the city.

11:10 they shall walk after the lord: he shall roar like a lion: when
h shall roar, then the children shall trembl from the west.

11:11 they shall trembl as a bird out of egypt, and as a dove out of
th land of assyria: and I will place them in their houses, saith the
lord.

11:12 ephraim compasseth me about with lies, and the hous of israel
with deceit: but judah yet ruleth with god, and is faith with the
saints.

12:1 ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he
daili increaseth lie and desolation; and they do make a coven with
th assyrians, and oil is carri into egypt.

12:2 the lord hath also a controversi with judah, and will punish
jacob accord to hi ways; accord to hi do will he
recompens him.

12:3 He took hi brother by the heel in the womb, and by hi strength
h had power with god: 12:4 yea, he had power over the angel, and
prevailed: he wept, and made supplic unto him: he found him in
bethel, and there he spake with us; 12:5 even the lord god of hosts;
th lord is hi memorial.

12:6 therefor turn thou to thi god: keep merci and judgment and wait
on thi god continually.

12:7 He is a merchant, the balanc of deceit are in hi hand: he
loveth to oppress.

12:8 and ephraim said, yet I am becom rich, I have found me out
substance: in all my labour they shall find none iniqu in me that
wer sin.

12:9 and I that am the lord thi god from the land of egypt will yet
mak thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the day of the solemn feast.

12:10 I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied
visions, and use similitudes, by the ministri of the prophets.

12:11 Is there iniqu in gilead? sure they are vanity: they
sacrific bullock in gilgal; yea, their altar are as heap in the
furrow of the fields.

12:12 and jacob fled into the countri of syria, and israel serv for
a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.

12:13 and by a prophet the lord brought israel out of egypt, and by a
prophet wa he preserved.

12:14 ephraim provok him to anger most bitterly: therefor shall he
leav hi blood upon him, and hi reproach shall hi lord return unto
him.

13:1 when ephraim spake trembling, he exalt himself in israel; but
when he offend in baal, he died.

13:2 and now they sin more and more, and have made them molten images
of their silver, and idol accord to their own understanding, all
of it the work of the craftsmen: they say of them, let the men that
sacrific kiss the calves.

13:3 therefor they shall be as the morn cloud and as the earli dew
that passeth away, as the chaff that is driven with the whirlwind out
of the floor, and as the smoke out of the chimney.

13:4 yet I am the lord thi god from the land of egypt, and thou shalt
know no god but me: for there is no saviour besid me.

13:5 I did know thee in the wilderness, in the land of great drought.

13:6 accord to their pasture, so were they filled; they were
filled, and their heart wa exalted; therefor have they forgotten me.

13:7 therefor I will be unto them as a lion: as a leopard by the way
wil I observ them: 13:8 I will meet them as a bear that is bereaved
of her whelps, and will rend the caul of their heart, and there will i
devour them like a lion: the wild beast shall tear them.

13:9 O israel, thou hast destroy thyself; but in me is thine help.

13:10 I will be thi king: where is ani other that may save thee in all
thi cities? and thi judg of whom thou saidst, give me a king and
princes?  13:11 I gave thee a king in mine anger, and took him away in
mi wrath.

13:12 the iniqu of ephraim is bound up; hi sin is hid.

13:13 the sorrow of a travail woman shall come upon him: he is an
unwis son; for he should not stay long in the place of the breaking
forth of children.

13:14 I will ransom them from the power of the grave; I will redeem
them from death: O death, I will be thi plagues; O grave, I will be
thi destruction: repent shall be hid from mine eyes.

13:15 though he be fruit among hi brethren, an east wind shall
come, the wind of the lord shall come up from the wilderness, and his
spr shall becom dry, and hi fountain shall be dri up: he shall
spoil the treasur of all pleasant vessels.

13:16 samaria shall becom desolate; for she hath rebel against her
god: they shall fall by the sword: their infant shall be dash in
pieces, and their women with child shall be rip up.

14:1 O israel, return unto the lord thi god; for thou hast fallen by
thin iniquity.

14:2 take with you words, and turn to the lord: say unto him, take
away all iniquity, and receiv us graciously: so will we render the
calv of our lips.

14:3 asshur shall not save us; we will not ride upon horses: neither
wil we say ani more to the work of our hands, Ye are our gods: for in
the the fatherless findeth mercy.

14:4 I will heal their backsliding, I will love them freely: for mine
ang is turn away from him.

14:5 I will be as the dew unto israel: he shall grow as the lily, and
cast forth hi root as lebanon.

14:6 hi branch shall spread, and hi beauti shall be as the olive
tree, and hi smell as lebanon.

14:7 they that dwell under hi shadow shall return; they shall revive
a the corn, and grow as the vine: the scent thereof shall be as the
win of lebanon.

14:8 ephraim shall say, what have I to do ani more with idols? I have
heard him, and observ him: I am like a green fir tree. from me is
thi fruit found.

14:9 who is wise, and he shall understand these things? prudent, and
h shall know them? for the way of the lord are right, and the just
shal walk in them: but the transgressor shall fall therein.




joel


1:1 the word of the lord that came to joel the son of pethuel.

1:2 hear this, ye old men, and give ear, all ye inhabit of the land.

hath thi been in your days, or even in the day of your fathers?  1:3
tell ye your children of it, and let your children tell their
children, and their children anoth generation.

1:4 that which the palmerworm hath left hath the locust eaten; and
that which the locust hath left hath the cankerworm eaten; and that
which the cankerworm hath left hath the caterpil eaten.

1:5 awake, ye drunkards, and weep; and howl, all ye drinker of wine,
becaus of the new wine; for it is cut off from your mouth.

1:6 for a nation is come up upon my land, strong, and without number,
whos teeth are the teeth of a lion, and he hath the cheek teeth of a
great lion.

1:7 He hath laid my vine waste, and bark my fig tree: he hath made
it clean bare, and cast it away; the branch thereof are made white.

1:8 lament like a virgin gird with sackcloth for the husband of her
youth.

1:9 the meat offer and the drink offer is cut off from the house
of the lord; the priests, the lord' ministers, mourn.

1:10 the field is wasted, the land mourneth; for the corn is wasted:
th new wine is dri up, the oil languisheth.

1:11 Be ye ashamed, O ye husbandmen; howl, O ye vinedressers, for the
wheat and for the barley; becaus the harvest of the field is
perished.

1:12 the vine is dri up, and the fig tree languisheth; the
pomegran tree, the palm tree also, and the appl tree, even all the
tre of the field, are withered: becaus joy is wither away from
th son of men.

1:13 gird yourselves, and lament, ye priests: howl, ye minist of
th altar: come, lie all night in sackcloth, ye minist of my god:
for the meat offer and the drink offer is withholden from the
hous of your god.

1:14 sanctifi ye a fast, call a solemn assembly, gather the elder and
al the inhabit of the land into the hous of the lord your god,
and cri unto the lord, 1:15 ala for the day! for the day of the lord
i at hand, and as a destruct from the almighti shall it come.

1:16 Is not the meat cut off befor our eyes, yea, joy and gladness
from the hous of our god?  1:17 the seed is rotten under their clods,
th garner are laid desolate, the barn are broken down; for the corn
i withered.

1:18 how do the beast groan! the herd of cattl are perplexed,
becaus they have no pasture; yea, the flock of sheep are made
desolate.

1:19 O lord, to thee will I cry: for the fire hath devour the
pastur of the wilderness, and the flame hath burn all the tree of
th field.

1:20 the beast of the field cri also unto thee: for the river of
wat are dri up, and the fire hath devour the pastur of the
wilderness.

2:1 blow ye the trumpet in zion, and sound an alarm in my holy
mountain: let all the inhabit of the land tremble: for the day of
th lord cometh, for it is nigh at hand; 2:2 A day of dark and of
gloominess, a day of cloud and of thick darkness, as the morning
spread upon the mountains: a great peopl and a strong; there hath not
been ever the like, neither shall be ani more after it, even to the
year of mani generations.

2:3 A fire devoureth befor them; and behind them a flame burneth: the
land is as the garden of eden befor them, and behind them a desolate
wilderness; yea, and noth shall escap them.

2:4 the appear of them is as the appear of horses; and as
horsemen, so shall they run.

2:5 like the nois of chariot on the top of mountain shall they
leap, like the nois of a flame of fire that devoureth the stubble, as
a strong peopl set in battl array.

2:6 befor their face the peopl shall be much pained: all face shall
gath blackness.

2:7 they shall run like mighti men; they shall climb the wall like men
of war; and they shall march everi one on hi ways, and they shall not
break their ranks: 2:8 neither shall one thrust another; they shall
walk everi one in hi path: and when they fall upon the sword, they
shal not be wounded.

2:9 they shall run to and fro in the city; they shall run upon the
wall, they shall climb up upon the houses; they shall enter in at the
window like a thief.

2:10 the earth shall quak befor them; the heaven shall tremble: the
sun and the moon shall be dark, and the star shall withdraw their
shining: 2:11 and the lord shall utter hi voic befor hi army: for
hi camp is veri great: for he is strong that executeth hi word: for
th day of the lord is great and veri terrible; and who can abid it?
2:12 therefor also now, saith the lord, turn ye even to me with all
your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning:
2:13 and rend your heart, and not your garments, and turn unto the
lord your god: for he is graciou and merciful, slow to anger, and of
great kindness, and repenteth him of the evil.

2:14 who knoweth if he will return and repent, and leav a blessing
behind him; even a meat offer and a drink offer unto the lord
your god?  2:15 blow the trumpet in zion, sanctifi a fast, call a
solemn assembly: 2:16 gather the people, sanctifi the congregation,
assembl the elders, gather the children, and those that suck the
breasts: let the bridegroom go forth of hi chamber, and the bride out
of her closet.

2:17 let the priests, the minist of the lord, weep between the
porch and the altar, and let them say, spare thi people, O lord, and
giv not thine heritag to reproach, that the heathen should rule over
them: wherefor should they say among the people, where is their god?
2:18 then will the lord be jealou for hi land, and piti hi people.

2:19 yea, the lord will answer and say unto hi people, behold, I will
send you corn, and wine, and oil, and ye shall be satisfi therewith:
and I will no more make you a reproach among the heathen: 2:20 but i
wil remov far off from you the northern army, and will drive him
into a land barren and desolate, with hi face toward the east sea,
and hi hinder part toward the utmost sea, and hi stink shall come
up, and hi ill savour shall come up, becaus he hath done great
things.

2:21 fear not, O land; be glad and rejoice: for the lord will do great
things.

2:22 Be not afraid, ye beast of the field: for the pastur of the
wild do spring, for the tree beareth her fruit, the fig tree and
th vine do yield their strength.

2:23 Be glad then, ye children of zion, and rejoic in the lord your
god: for he hath given you the former rain moderately, and he will
caus to come down for you the rain, the former rain, and the latter
rain in the first month.

2:24 and the floor shall be full of wheat, and the vat shall
overflow with wine and oil.

2:25 and I will restor to you the year that the locust hath eaten,
th cankerworm, and the caterpiller, and the palmerworm, my great army
which I sent among you.

2:26 and ye shall eat in plenty, and be satisfied, and prais the name
of the lord your god, that hath dealt wondrous with you: and my
peopl shall never be ashamed.

2:27 and ye shall know that I am in the midst of israel, and that I am
th lord your god, and none else: and my peopl shall never be
ashamed.

2:28 and it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my
spirit upon all flesh; and your son and your daughter shall
prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, your young men shall see
visions: 2:29 and also upon the servant and upon the handmaid in
thos day will I pour out my spirit.

2:30 and I will shew wonder in the heaven and in the earth, blood,
and fire, and pillar of smoke.

2:31 the sun shall be turn into darkness, and the moon into blood,
befor the great and terribl day of the lord come.

2:32 and it shall come to pass, that whosoev shall call on the name
of the lord shall be delivered: for in mount zion and in jerusalem
shal be deliverance, as the lord hath said, and in the remnant whom
th lord shall call.

3:1 for, behold, in those days, and in that time, when I shall bring
again the captiv of judah and jerusalem, 3:2 I will also gather all
nations, and will bring them down into the valley of jehoshaphat, and
wil plead with them there for my peopl and for my heritag israel,
whom they have scatter among the nations, and part my land.

3:3 and they have cast lot for my people; and have given a boy for an
harlot, and sold a girl for wine, that they might drink.

3:4 yea, and what have ye to do with me, O tyre, and zidon, and all
th coast of palestine? will ye render me a recompence? and if ye
recompens me, swiftli and speedili will I return your recomp upon
your own head; 3:5 becaus ye have taken my silver and my gold, and
hav carri into your templ my goodli pleasant things: 3:6 the
children also of judah and the children of jerusalem have ye sold unto
th grecians, that ye might remov them far from their border.

3:7 behold, I will rais them out of the place whither ye have sold
them, and will return your recomp upon your own head: 3:8 and i
wil sell your son and your daughter into the hand of the children
of judah, and they shall sell them to the sabeans, to a peopl far
off: for the lord hath spoken it.

3:9 proclaim ye thi among the gentiles; prepar war, wake up the
mighti men, let all the men of war draw near; let them come up: 3:10
beat your plowshar into sword and your pruninghook into spears:
let the weak say, I am strong.

3:11 assembl yourselves, and come, all ye heathen, and gather
yourselv togeth round about: thither caus thi mighti one to come
down, O lord.

3:12 let the heathen be wakened, and come up to the valley of
jehoshaphat: for there will I sit to judg all the heathen round
about.

3:13 put ye in the sickle, for the harvest is ripe: come, get you
down; for the press is full, the fat overflow; for their wickedness
i great.

3:14 multitudes, multitud in the valley of decision: for the day of
th lord is near in the valley of decision.

3:15 the sun and the moon shall be darkened, and the star shall
withdraw their shining.

3:16 the lord also shall roar out of zion, and utter hi voic from
jerusalem; and the heaven and the earth shall shake: but the lord
wil be the hope of hi people, and the strength of the children of
israel.

3:17 So shall ye know that I am the lord your god dwell in zion, my
holi mountain: then shall jerusalem be holy, and there shall no
strang pass through her ani more.

3:18 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the mountain shall
drop down new wine, and the hill shall flow with milk, and all the
riv of judah shall flow with waters, and a fountain shall come
forth out of the hous of the lord, and shall water the valley of
shittim.

3:19 egypt shall be a desolation, and edom shall be a desolate
wilderness, for the violenc against the children of judah, because
they have shed innoc blood in their land.

3:20 but judah shall dwell for ever, and jerusalem from gener to
generation.

3:21 for I will cleans their blood that I have not cleansed: for the
lord dwelleth in zion.




amos


1:1 the word of amos, who wa among the herdmen of tekoa, which he
saw concern israel in the day of uzziah king of judah, and in the
day of jeroboam the son of joash king of israel, two year befor the
earthquake.

1:2 and he said, the lord will roar from zion, and utter hi voice
from jerusalem; and the habit of the shepherd shall mourn, and
th top of carmel shall wither.

1:3 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of damascus, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they have
thresh gilead with thresh instrument of iron: 1:4 but I will
send a fire into the hous of hazael, which shall devour the palaces
of benhadad.

1:5 I will break also the bar of damascus, and cut off the inhabitant
from the plain of aven, and him that holdeth the sceptr from the
hous of eden: and the peopl of syria shall go into captiv unto
kir, saith the lord.

1:6 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of gaza, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they
carri away captiv the whole captivity, to deliv them up to edom:
1:7 but I will send a fire on the wall of gaza, which shall devour the
palac thereof: 1:8 and I will cut off the inhabit from ashdod,
and him that holdeth the sceptr from ashkelon, and I will turn mine
hand against ekron: and the remnant of the philistin shall perish,
saith the lord god.

1:9 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of tyrus, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they
deliv up the whole captiv to edom, and rememb not the
brotherli covenant: 1:10 but I will send a fire on the wall of tyrus,
which shall devour the palac thereof.

1:11 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of edom, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus he did
pursu hi brother with the sword, and did cast off all pity, and his
ang did tear perpetually, and he kept hi wrath for ever: 1:12 but i
wil send a fire upon teman, which shall devour the palac of bozrah.

1:13 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of the children of
ammon, and for four, I will not turn away the punish thereof;
becaus they have rip up the women with child of gilead, that they
might enlarg their border: 1:14 but I will kindl a fire in the wall
of rabbah, and it shall devour the palac thereof, with shout in
th day of battle, with a tempest in the day of the whirlwind: 1:15
and their king shall go into captivity, he and hi princ together,
saith the lord.

2:1 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of moab, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus he burned
th bone of the king of edom into lime: 2:2 but I will send a fire
upon moab, and it shall devour the palac of kirioth: and moab shall
di with tumult, with shouting, and with the sound of the trumpet: 2:3
and I will cut off the judg from the midst thereof, and will slay all
th princ thereof with him, saith the lord.

2:4 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of judah, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they have
despis the law of the lord, and have not kept hi commandments, and
their lie caus them to err, after the which their father have
walked: 2:5 but I will send a fire upon judah, and it shall devour the
palac of jerusalem.

2:6 thu saith the lord; for three transgress of israel, and for
four, I will not turn away the punish thereof; becaus they sold
th righteou for silver, and the poor for a pair of shoes; 2:7 that
pant after the dust of the earth on the head of the poor, and turn
asid the way of the meek: and a man and hi father will go in unto
th same maid, to profan my holi name: 2:8 and they lay themselves
down upon cloth laid to pledg by everi altar, and they drink the
win of the condemn in the hous of their god.

2:9 yet destroy I the amorit befor them, whose height wa like the
height of the cedars, and he wa strong as the oaks; yet I destroyed
hi fruit from above, and hi root from beneath.

2:10 also I brought you up from the land of egypt, and led you forty
year through the wilderness, to possess the land of the amorite.

2:11 and I rais up of your son for prophets, and of your young men
for nazarites. Is it not even thus, O ye children of israel? saith the
lord.

2:12 but ye gave the nazarit wine to drink; and command the
prophets, saying, prophesi not.

2:13 behold, I am press under you, as a cart is press that is full
of sheaves.

2:14 therefor the flight shall perish from the swift, and the strong
shal not strengthen hi force, neither shall the mighti deliver
himself: 2:15 neither shall he stand that handleth the bow; and he
that is swift of foot shall not deliv himself: neither shall he that
rideth the hors deliv himself.

2:16 and he that is courag among the mighti shall flee away naked
in that day, saith the lord.

3:1 hear thi word that the lord hath spoken against you, O children
of israel, against the whole famili which I brought up from the land
of egypt, saying, 3:2 you onli have I known of all the famili of the
earth: therefor I will punish you for all your iniquities.

3:3 can two walk together, except they be agreed?  3:4 will a lion
roar in the forest, when he hath no prey? will a young lion cri out of
hi den, if he have taken nothing?  3:5 can a bird fall in a snare
upon the earth, where no gin is for him?  shall one take up a snare
from the earth, and have taken noth at all?  3:6 shall a trumpet be
blown in the city, and the peopl not be afraid?  shall there be evil
in a city, and the lord hath not done it?  3:7 sure the lord god
wil do nothing, but he revealeth hi secret unto hi servant the
prophets.

3:8 the lion hath roared, who will not fear? the lord god hath spoken,
who can but prophesy?  3:9 publish in the palac at ashdod, and in
th palac in the land of egypt, and say, assembl yourselv upon
th mountain of samaria, and behold the great tumult in the midst
thereof, and the oppress in the midst thereof.

3:10 for they know not to do right, saith the lord, who store up
viol and robberi in their palaces.

3:11 therefor thu saith the lord god; An adversari there shall be
even round about the land; and he shall bring down thi strength from
thee, and thi palac shall be spoiled.

3:12 thu saith the lord; As the shepherd taketh out of the mouth of
th lion two legs, or a piec of an ear; so shall the children of
israel be taken out that dwell in samaria in the corner of a bed, and
in damascu in a couch.

3:13 hear ye, and testifi in the hous of jacob, saith the lord god,
th god of hosts, 3:14 that in the day that I shall visit the
transgress of israel upon him I will also visit the altar of
bethel: and the horn of the altar shall be cut off, and fall to the
ground.

3:15 and I will smite the winter hous with the summer house; and the
hous of ivori shall perish, and the great hous shall have an end,
saith the lord.

4:1 hear thi word, ye kine of bashan, that are in the mountain of
samaria, which oppress the poor, which crush the needy, which say to
their masters, bring, and let us drink.

4:2 the lord god hath sworn by hi holiness, that, lo, the day shall
com upon you, that he will take you away with hooks, and your
poster with fishhooks.

4:3 and ye shall go out at the breaches, everi cow at that which is
befor her; and ye shall cast them into the palace, saith the lord.

4:4 come to bethel, and transgress; at gilgal multipli transgression;
and bring your sacrific everi morning, and your tith after three
years: 4:5 and offer a sacrific of thanksgiv with leaven, and
proclaim and publish the free offerings: for thi liketh you, O ye
children of israel, saith the lord god.

4:6 and I also have given you clean of teeth in all your cities,
and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not return unto
me, saith the lord.

4:7 and also I have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet
thre month to the harvest: and I caus it to rain upon one city,
and caus it not to rain upon anoth city: one piec wa rained
upon, and the piec whereupon it rain not withered.

4:8 So two or three citi wander unto one city, to drink water; but
they were not satisfied: yet have ye not return unto me, saith the
lord.

4:9 I have smitten you with blast and mildew: when your garden and
your vineyard and your fig tree and your oliv tree increased, the
palmerworm devour them: yet have ye not return unto me, saith the
lord.

4:10 I have sent among you the pestil after the manner of egypt:
your young men have I slain with the sword, and have taken away your
horses; and I have made the stink of your camp to come up unto your
nostrils: yet have ye not return unto me, saith the lord.

4:11 I have overthrown some of you, as god overthrew sodom and
gomorrah, and ye were as a firebrand pluck out of the burning: yet
hav ye not return unto me, saith the lord.

4:12 therefor thu will I do unto thee, O israel: and becaus I will
do thi unto thee, prepar to meet thi god, O israel.

4:13 for, lo, he that formeth the mountains, and createth the wind,
and declareth unto man what is hi thought, that maketh the morning
darkness, and treadeth upon the high place of the earth, the lord,
th god of hosts, is hi name.

5:1 hear ye thi word which I take up against you, even a lamentation,
o hous of israel.

5:2 the virgin of israel is fallen; she shall no more rise: she is
forsaken upon her land; there is none to rais her up.

5:3 for thu saith the lord god; the citi that went out by a thousand
shal leav an hundred, and that which went forth by an hundr shall
leav ten, to the hous of israel.

5:4 for thu saith the lord unto the hous of israel, seek ye me, and
y shall live: 5:5 but seek not bethel, nor enter into gilgal, and
pass not to beersheba: for gilgal shall sure go into captivity, and
bethel shall come to nought.

5:6 seek the lord, and ye shall live; lest he break out like fire in
th hous of joseph, and devour it, and there be none to quench it in
bethel.

5:7 Ye who turn judgment to wormwood, and leav off righteous in
th earth, 5:8 seek him that maketh the seven star and orion, and
turneth the shadow of death into the morning, and maketh the day dark
with night: that calleth for the water of the sea, and poureth them
out upon the face of the earth: the lord is hi name: 5:9 that
strengtheneth the spoil against the strong, so that the spoiled
shal come against the fortress.

5:10 they hate him that rebuketh in the gate, and they abhor him that
speaketh uprightly.

5:11 forasmuch therefor as your tread is upon the poor, and ye
tak from him burden of wheat: ye have built hous of hewn stone,
but ye shall not dwell in them; ye have plant pleasant vineyards,
but ye shall not drink wine of them.
