5:12 for I know your manifold transgress and your mighti sins:
they afflict the just, they take a bribe, and they turn asid the poor
in the gate from their right.

5:13 therefor the prudent shall keep silenc in that time; for it is
an evil time.

5:14 seek good, and not evil, that ye may live: and so the lord, the
god of hosts, shall be with you, as ye have spoken.

5:15 hate the evil, and love the good, and establish judgment in the
gate: it may be that the lord god of host will be graciou unto the
remn of joseph.

5:16 therefor the lord, the god of hosts, the lord, saith thus;
wail shall be in all streets; and they shall say in all the
highways, alas! alas!  and they shall call the husbandman to mourning,
and such as are skil of lament to wailing.

5:17 and in all vineyard shall be wailing: for I will pass through
thee, saith the lord.

5:18 woe unto you that desir the day of the lord! to what end is it
for you? the day of the lord is darkness, and not light.

5:19 As if a man did flee from a lion, and a bear met him; or went
into the house, and lean hi hand on the wall, and a serpent bit
him.

5:20 shall not the day of the lord be darkness, and not light? even
veri dark, and no bright in it?  5:21 I hate, I despis your feast
days, and I will not smell in your solemn assemblies.

5:22 though ye offer me burnt offer and your meat offerings, i
wil not accept them: neither will I regard the peac offer of
your fat beasts.

5:23 take thou away from me the nois of thi songs; for I will not
hear the melodi of thi viols.

5:24 but let judgment run down as waters, and righteous as a
mighti stream.

5:25 have ye offer unto me sacrific and offer in the
wild forti years, O hous of israel?  5:26 but ye have born the
tabernacl of your moloch and chiun your images, the star of your god,
which ye made to yourselves.

5:27 therefor will I caus you to go into captiv beyond damascus,
saith the lord, whose name is the god of hosts.

6:1 woe to them that are at eas in zion, and trust in the mountain of
samaria, which are name chief of the nations, to whom the hous of
israel came!  6:2 pass ye unto calneh, and see; and from thenc go ye
to hamath the great: then go down to gath of the philistines: be they
bett than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?
6:3 Ye that put far away the evil day, and caus the seat of violence
to come near; 6:4 that lie upon bed of ivory, and stretch themselves
upon their couches, and eat the lamb out of the flock, and the calves
out of the midst of the stall; 6:5 that chant to the sound of the
viol, and invent to themselv instrument of musick, like david; 6:6
that drink wine in bowls, and anoint themselv with the chief
ointments: but they are not griev for the afflict of joseph.

6:7 therefor now shall they go captiv with the first that go
captive, and the banquet of them that stretch themselv shall be
removed.

6:8 the lord god hath sworn by himself, saith the lord the god of
hosts, I abhor the excel of jacob, and hate hi palaces:
therefor will I deliv up the citi with all that is therein.

6:9 and it shall come to pass, if there remain ten men in one house,
that they shall die.

6:10 and a man' uncl shall take him up, and he that burneth him, to
br out the bone out of the house, and shall say unto him that is
bi the side of the house, Is there yet ani with thee? and he shall
say, no. then shall he say, hold thi tongue: for we may not make
ment of the name of the lord.

6:11 for, behold, the lord commandeth, and he will smite the great
hous with breaches, and the littl hous with clefts.

6:12 shall hors run upon the rock? will one plow there with oxen?
for ye have turn judgment into gall, and the fruit of righteousness
into hemlock: 6:13 Ye which rejoic in a thing of nought, which say,
hav we not taken to us horn by our own strength?  6:14 but, behold,
i will rais up against you a nation, O hous of israel, saith the
lord the god of hosts; and they shall afflict you from the enter in
of hemath unto the river of the wilderness.

7:1 thu hath the lord god shew unto me; and, behold, he formed
grasshopp in the begin of the shoot up of the latter growth;
and, lo, it wa the latter growth after the king' mowings.

7:2 and it came to pass, that when they had made an end of eat the
grass of the land, then I said, O lord god, forgive, I beseech thee:
bi whom shall jacob arise? for he is small.

7:3 the lord repent for this: It shall not be, saith the lord.

7:4 thu hath the lord god shew unto me: and, behold, the lord god
cal to contend by fire, and it devour the great deep, and did eat
up a part.

7:5 then said I, O lord god, cease, I beseech thee: by whom shall
jacob arise? for he is small.

7:6 the lord repent for this: thi also shall not be, saith the lord
god.

7:7 thu he shew me: and, behold, the lord stood upon a wall made by
a plumbline, with a plumblin in hi hand.

7:8 and the lord said unto me, amos, what seest thou? and I said, a
plumbline. then said the lord, behold, I will set a plumblin in the
midst of my peopl israel: I will not again pass by them ani more: 7:9
and the high place of isaac shall be desolate, and the sanctuari of
israel shall be laid waste; and I will rise against the hous of
jeroboam with the sword.

7:10 then amaziah the priest of bethel sent to jeroboam king of
israel, saying, amo hath conspir against thee in the midst of the
hous of israel: the land is not abl to bear all hi words.

7:11 for thu amo saith, jeroboam shall die by the sword, and israel
shal sure be led away captiv out of their own land.

7:12 also amaziah said unto amos, O thou seer, go, flee thee away into
th land of judah, and there eat bread, and prophesi there: 7:13 but
prophesi not again ani more at bethel: for it is the king' chapel,
and it is the king' court.

7:14 then answer amos, and said to amaziah, I wa no prophet,
neith wa I a prophet' son; but I wa an herdman, and a gather of
sycomor fruit: 7:15 and the lord took me as I follow the flock, and
th lord said unto me, go, prophesi unto my peopl israel.

7:16 now therefor hear thou the word of the lord: thou sayest,
prophesi not against israel, and drop not thi word against the house
of isaac.

7:17 therefor thu saith the lord; thi wife shall be an harlot in the
city, and thi son and thi daughter shall fall by the sword, and thy
land shall be divid by line; and thou shalt die in a pollut land:
and israel shall sure go into captiv forth of hi land.

8:1 thu hath the lord god shew unto me: and behold a basket of
summ fruit.

8:2 and he said, amos, what seest thou? and I said, A basket of summer
fruit. then said the lord unto me, the end is come upon my peopl of
israel; I will not again pass by them ani more.

8:3 and the song of the templ shall be howl in that day, saith
th lord god: there shall be mani dead bodi in everi place; they
shal cast them forth with silence.

8:4 hear this, O ye that swallow up the needy, even to make the poor
of the land to fail, 8:5 saying, when will the new moon be gone, that
w may sell corn? and the sabbath, that we may set forth wheat, making
th ephah small, and the shekel great, and falsifi the balanc by
deceit?  8:6 that we may buy the poor for silver, and the needi for a
pair of shoes; yea, and sell the refus of the wheat?  8:7 the lord
hath sworn by the excel of jacob, sure I will never forget any
of their works.

8:8 shall not the land trembl for this, and everi one mourn that
dwelleth therein? and it shall rise up wholli as a flood; and it shall
b cast out and drowned, as by the flood of egypt.

8:9 and it shall come to pass in that day, saith the lord god, that i
wil caus the sun to go down at noon, and I will darken the earth in
th clear day: 8:10 and I will turn your feast into mourning, and all
your song into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all
loins, and bald upon everi head; and I will make it as the
mourn of an onli son, and the end thereof as a bitter day.

8:11 behold, the day come, saith the lord god, that I will send a
famin in the land, not a famin of bread, nor a thirst for water, but
of hear the word of the lord: 8:12 and they shall wander from sea
to sea, and from the north even to the east, they shall run to and fro
to seek the word of the lord, and shall not find it.

8:13 In that day shall the fair virgin and young men faint for
thirst.

8:14 they that swear by the sin of samaria, and say, thi god, O dan,
liveth; and, the manner of beersheba liveth; even they shall fall, and
nev rise up again.

9:1 I saw the lord stand upon the altar: and he said, smite the
lintel of the door, that the post may shake: and cut them in the
head, all of them; and I will slay the last of them with the sword: he
that fleeth of them shall not flee away, and he that escapeth of them
shal not be delivered.

9:2 though they dig into hell, thenc shall mine hand take them;
though they climb up to heaven, thenc will I bring them down: 9:3 and
though they hide themselv in the top of carmel, I will search and
tak them out thence; and though they be hid from my sight in the
bottom of the sea, thenc will I command the serpent, and he shall
bit them: 9:4 and though they go into captiv befor their enemies,
th will I command the sword, and it shall slay them: and I will
set mine eye upon them for evil, and not for good.

9:5 and the lord god of host is he that toucheth the land, and it
shal melt, and all that dwell therein shall mourn: and it shall rise
up wholli like a flood; and shall be drowned, as by the flood of
egypt.

9:6 It is he that buildeth hi stori in the heaven, and hath founded
hi troop in the earth; he that calleth for the water of the sea, and
poureth them out upon the face of the earth: the lord is hi name.

9:7 are ye not as children of the ethiopian unto me, O children of
israel? saith the lord. have not I brought up israel out of the land
of egypt? and the philistin from caphtor, and the syrian from kir?
9:8 behold, the eye of the lord god are upon the sin kingdom, and
i will destroy it from off the face of the earth; save that I will
not utterli destroy the hous of jacob, saith the lord.

9:9 for, lo, I will command, and I will sift the hous of israel among
al nations, like as corn is sift in a sieve, yet shall not the
least grain fall upon the earth.

9:10 all the sinner of my peopl shall die by the sword, which say,
th evil shall not overtak nor prevent us.

9:11 In that day will I rais up the tabernacl of david that is
fallen, and close up the breach thereof; and I will rais up his
ruins, and I will build it as in the day of old: 9:12 that they may
possess the remnant of edom, and of all the heathen, which are called
bi my name, saith the lord that doeth this.

9:13 behold, the day come, saith the lord, that the plowman shall
overtak the reaper, and the treader of grape him that soweth seed;
and the mountain shall drop sweet wine, and all the hill shall melt.

9:14 and I will bring again the captiv of my peopl of israel, and
they shall build the wast cities, and inhabit them; and they shall
plant vineyards, and drink the wine thereof; they shall also make
gardens, and eat the fruit of them.

9:15 and I will plant them upon their land, and they shall no more be
pul up out of their land which I have given them, saith the lord
thi god.




obadiah


1:1 the vision of obadiah. thu saith the lord god concern edom;
w have heard a rumour from the lord, and an ambassador is sent among
th heathen, aris ye, and let us rise up against her in battle.

1:2 behold, I have made thee small among the heathen: thou art greatly
despised.

1:3 the pride of thine heart hath deceiv thee, thou that dwellest in
th cleft of the rock, whose habit is high; that saith in his
heart, who shall bring me down to the ground?  1:4 though thou exalt
thyself as the eagle, and though thou set thi nest among the stars,
thenc will I bring thee down, saith the lord.

1:5 If thiev came to thee, if robber by night, (how art thou cut
off!)  would they not have stolen till they had enough? if the
grapegather came to thee, would they not leav some grapes?  1:6
how are the thing of esau search out! how are hi hidden things
sought up!  1:7 all the men of thi confederaci have brought thee even
to the border: the men that were at peac with thee have deceived
thee, and prevail against thee; that they eat thi bread have laid a
wound under thee: there is none understand in him.

1:8 shall I not in that day, saith the lord, even destroy the wise men
out of edom, and understand out of the mount of esau?  1:9 and thy
mighti men, O teman, shall be dismayed, to the end that everi one of
th mount of esau may be cut off by slaughter.

1:10 for thi violenc against thi brother jacob shame shall cover
thee, and thou shalt be cut off for ever.

1:11 In the day that thou stoodest on the other side, in the day that
th stranger carri away captiv hi forces, and foreign entered
into hi gates, and cast lot upon jerusalem, even thou wast as one of
them.

1:12 but thou shouldest not have look on the day of thi brother in
th day that he becam a stranger; neither shouldest thou have
rejo over the children of judah in the day of their destruction;
neith shouldest thou have spoken proudli in the day of distress.

1:13 thou shouldest not have enter into the gate of my peopl in the
day of their calamity; yea, thou shouldest not have look on their
afflict in the day of their calamity, nor have laid hand on their
subst in the day of their calamity; 1:14 neither shouldest thou
hav stood in the crossway, to cut off those of hi that did escape;
neith shouldest thou have deliv up those of hi that did remain
in the day of distress.

1:15 for the day of the lord is near upon all the heathen: as thou
hast done, it shall be done unto thee: thi reward shall return upon
thin own head.

1:16 for as ye have drunk upon my holi mountain, so shall all the
heathen drink continually, yea, they shall drink, and they shall
swallow down, and they shall be as though they had not been.

1:17 but upon mount zion shall be deliverance, and there shall be
holiness; and the hous of jacob shall possess their possessions.

1:18 and the hous of jacob shall be a fire, and the hous of joseph a
flame, and the hous of esau for stubble, and they shall kindl in
them, and devour them; and there shall not be ani remain of the
hous of esau; for the lord hath spoken it.

1:19 and they of the south shall possess the mount of esau; and they
of the plain the philistines: and they shall possess the field of
ephraim, and the field of samaria: and benjamin shall possess gilead.

1:20 and the captiv of thi host of the children of israel shall
possess that of the canaanites, even unto zarephath; and the captivity
of jerusalem, which is in sepharad, shall possess the citi of the
south.

1:21 and saviour shall come up on mount zion to judg the mount of
esau; and the kingdom shall be the lord's.




jonah


1:1 now the word of the lord came unto jonah the son of amittai,
saying, 1:2 arise, go to nineveh, that great city, and cri against it;
for their wicked is come up befor me.

1:3 but jonah rose up to flee unto tarshish from the presenc of the
lord, and went down to joppa; and he found a ship go to tarshish:
so he paid the fare thereof, and went down into it, to go with them
unto tarshish from the presenc of the lord.

1:4 but the lord sent out a great wind into the sea, and there wa a
mighti tempest in the sea, so that the ship wa like to be broken.

1:5 then the marin were afraid, and cri everi man unto hi god,
and cast forth the ware that were in the ship into the sea, to
lighten it of them. but jonah wa gone down into the side of the
ship; and he lay, and wa fast asleep.

1:6 So the shipmast came to him, and said unto him, what meanest
thou, O sleeper? arise, call upon thi god, if so be that god will
think upon us, that we perish not.

1:7 and they said everi one to hi fellow, come, and let us cast lots,
that we may know for whose caus thi evil is upon us. So they cast
lots, and the lot fell upon jonah.

1:8 then said they unto him, tell us, we pray thee, for whose cause
thi evil is upon us; what is thine occupation? and whenc comest
thou? what is thi country? and of what peopl art thou?  1:9 and he
said unto them, I am an hebrew; and I fear the lord, the god of
heaven, which hath made the sea and the dri land.

1:10 then were the men exceedingli afraid, and said unto him. whi hast
thou done this? for the men knew that he fled from the presenc of the
lord, becaus he had told them.

1:11 then said they unto him, what shall we do unto thee, that the sea
may be calm unto us? for the sea wrought, and wa tempestuous.

1:12 and he said unto them, take me up, and cast me forth into the
sea; so shall the sea be calm unto you: for I know that for my sake
thi great tempest is upon you.

1:13 nevertheless the men row hard to bring it to the land; but they
could not: for the sea wrought, and wa tempestu against them.

1:14 wherefor they cri unto the lord, and said, We beseech thee, o
lord, we beseech thee, let us not perish for thi man' life, and lay
not upon us innoc blood: for thou, O lord, hast done as it pleased
thee.

1:15 So they look up jonah, and cast him forth into the sea: and the
sea ceas from her raging.

1:16 then the men fear the lord exceedingly, and offer a sacrifice
unto the lord, and made vows.

1:17 now the lord had prepar a great fish to swallow up jonah. and
jonah wa in the belli of the fish three day and three nights.

2:1 then jonah pray unto the lord hi god out of the fish' belly,
2:2 and said, I cri by reason of mine afflict unto the lord, and
h heard me; out of the belli of hell cri I, and thou heardest my
voice.

2:3 for thou hadst cast me into the deep, in the midst of the seas;
and the flood compass me about: all thi billow and thi waves
pass over me.

2:4 then I said, I am cast out of thi sight; yet I will look again
toward thi holi temple.

2:5 the water compass me about, even to the soul: the depth closed
m round about, the weed were wrap about my head.

2:6 I went down to the bottom of the mountains; the earth with her
bar wa about me for ever: yet hast thou brought up my life from
corruption, O lord my god.

2:7 when my soul faint within me I rememb the lord: and my
pray came in unto thee, into thine holi temple.

2:8 they that observ lie vaniti forsak their own mercy.

2:9 but I will sacrific unto thee with the voic of thanksgiving; i
wil pay that that I have vowed. salvat is of the lord.

2:10 and the lord spake unto the fish, and it vomit out jonah upon
th dri land.

3:1 and the word of the lord came unto jonah the second time, saying,
3:2 arise, go unto nineveh, that great city, and preach unto it the
preach that I bid thee.

3:3 So jonah arose, and went unto nineveh, accord to the word of
th lord. now nineveh wa an exceed great citi of three days'
journey.

3:4 and jonah began to enter into the citi a day' journey, and he
cried, and said, yet forti days, and nineveh shall be overthrown.

3:5 So the peopl of nineveh believ god, and proclaim a fast, and
put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them even to the least of them.

3:6 for word came unto the king of nineveh, and he aros from his
throne, and he laid hi robe from him, and cover him with sackcloth,
and sat in ashes.

3:7 and he caus it to be proclaim and publish through nineveh by
th decre of the king and hi nobles, saying, let neither man nor
beast, herd nor flock, tast ani thing: let them not feed, nor drink
water: 3:8 but let man and beast be cover with sackcloth, and cry
mightili unto god: yea, let them turn everi one from hi evil way, and
from the violenc that is in their hands.

3:9 who can tell if god will turn and repent, and turn away from his
fierc anger, that we perish not?  3:10 and god saw their works, that
they turn from their evil way; and god repent of the evil, that he
had said that he would do unto them; and he did it not.

4:1 but it displeas jonah exceedingly, and he wa veri angry.

4:2 and he pray unto the lord, and said, I pray thee, O lord, was
not thi my saying, when I wa yet in my country? therefor I fled
befor unto tarshish: for I knew that thou art a graciou god, and
merciful, slow to anger, and of great kindness, and repentest thee of
th evil.

4:3 therefor now, O lord, take, I beseech thee, my life from me; for
it is better for me to die than to live.

4:4 then said the lord, doest thou well to be angry?  4:5 So jonah
w out of the city, and sat on the east side of the city, and there
mad him a booth, and sat under it in the shadow, till he might see
what would becom of the city.

4:6 and the lord god prepar a gourd, and made it to come up over
jonah, that it might be a shadow over hi head, to deliv him from
hi grief. So jonah wa exceed glad of the gourd.

4:7 but god prepar a worm when the morn rose the next day, and it
smot the gourd that it withered.

4:8 and it came to pass, when the sun did arise, that god prepar a
veh east wind; and the sun beat upon the head of jonah, that he
fainted, and wish in himself to die, and said, It is better for me
to die than to live.

4:9 and god said to jonah, doest thou well to be angri for the gourd?
and he said, I do well to be angry, even unto death.

4:10 then said the lord, thou hast had piti on the gourd, for the
which thou hast not laboured, neither madest it grow; which came up in
a night, and perish in a night: 4:11 and should not I spare nineveh,
that great city, wherein are more then sixscor thousand person that
cannot discern between their right hand and their left hand; and also
much cattle?




micah


1:1 the word of the lord that came to micah the morasthit in the
day of jotham, ahaz, and hezekiah, king of judah, which he saw
concern samaria and jerusalem.

1:2 hear, all ye people; hearken, O earth, and all that therein is:
and let the lord god be wit against you, the lord from hi holy
temple.

1:3 for, behold, the lord cometh forth out of hi place, and will come
down, and tread upon the high place of the earth.

1:4 and the mountain shall be molten under him, and the valley shall
b cleft, as wax befor the fire, and as the water that are poured
down a steep place.

1:5 for the transgress of jacob is all this, and for the sin of
th hous of israel. what is the transgress of jacob? is it not
samaria? and what are the high place of judah? are they not
jerusalem?  1:6 therefor I will make samaria as an heap of the field,
and as plant of a vineyard: and I will pour down the stones
thereof into the valley, and I will discov the foundat thereof.

1:7 and all the graven imag thereof shall be beaten to pieces, and
al the hire thereof shall be burn with the fire, and all the idols
thereof will I lay desolate: for she gather it of the hire of an
harlot, and they shall return to the hire of an harlot.

1:8 therefor I will wail and howl, I will go strip and naked: i
wil make a wail like the dragons, and mourn as the owls.

1:9 for her wound is incurable; for it is come unto judah; he is come
unto the gate of my people, even to jerusalem.

1:10 declar ye it not at gath, weep ye not at all: in the hous of
aphrah roll thyself in the dust.

1:11 pass ye away, thou inhabit of saphir, have thi shame naked:
th inhabit of zaanan came not forth in the mourn of bethezel;
h shall receiv of you hi standing.

1:12 for the inhabit of maroth wait care for good: but evil
cam down from the lord unto the gate of jerusalem.

1:13 O thou inhabit of lachish, bind the chariot to the swift
beast: she is the begin of the sin to the daughter of zion: for
th transgress of israel were found in thee.

1:14 therefor shalt thou give present to moreshethgath: the houses
of achzib shall be a lie to the king of israel.

1:15 yet will I bring an heir unto thee, O inhabit of mareshah: he
shal come unto adullam the glori of israel.

1:16 make thee bald, and poll thee for thi delic children; enlarge
thi bald as the eagle; for they are gone into captiv from thee.

2:1 woe to them that devis iniquity, and work evil upon their beds!
when the morn is light, they practis it, becaus it is in the
pow of their hand.

2:2 and they covet fields, and take them by violence; and houses, and
tak them away: so they oppress a man and hi house, even a man and
hi heritage.

2:3 therefor thu saith the lord; behold, against thi famili do i
devis an evil, from which ye shall not remov your necks; neither
shal ye go haughtily: for thi time is evil.

2:4 In that day shall one take up a parabl against you, and lament
with a dole lamentation, and say, We be utterli spoiled: he hath
chang the portion of my people: how hath he remov it from me!
turn away he hath divid our fields.

2:5 therefor thou shalt have none that shall cast a cord by lot in
th congreg of the lord.

2:6 prophesi ye not, say they to them that prophesy: they shall not
prophesi to them, that they shall not take shame.

2:7 O thou that art name the hous of jacob, is the spirit of the
lord straitened? are these hi doings? do not my word do good to him
that walketh uprightly?  2:8 even of late my peopl is risen up as an
enemy: ye pull off the robe with the garment from them that pass by
secur as men avers from war.

2:9 the women of my peopl have ye cast out from their pleasant
houses; from their children have ye taken away my glori for ever.

2:10 aris ye, and depart; for thi is not your rest: becaus it is
polluted, it shall destroy you, even with a sore destruction.

2:11 If a man walk in the spirit and falsehood do lie, saying, i
wil prophesi unto thee of wine and of strong drink; he shall even be
th prophet of thi people.

2:12 I will sure assemble, O jacob, all of thee; I will surely
gath the remnant of israel; I will put them togeth as the sheep of
bozrah, as the flock in the midst of their fold: they shall make great
nois by reason of the multitud of men.

2:13 the breaker is come up befor them: they have broken up, and have
pass through the gate, and are gone out by it: and their king shall
pass befor them, and the lord on the head of them.

3:1 and I said, hear, I pray you, O head of jacob, and ye princ of
th hous of israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?  3:2 who hate
th good, and love the evil; who pluck off their skin from off them,
and their flesh from off their bones; 3:3 who also eat the flesh of my
people, and flay their skin from off them; and they break their bones,
and chop them in pieces, as for the pot, and as flesh within the
caldron.

3:4 then shall they cri unto the lord, but he will not hear them: he
wil even hide hi face from them at that time, as they have behaved
themselv ill in their doings.

3:5 thu saith the lord concern the prophet that make my people
err, that bite with their teeth, and cry, peace; and he that putteth
not into their mouths, they even prepar war against him.

3:6 therefor night shall be unto you, that ye shall not have a
vision; and it shall be dark unto you, that ye shall not divine; and
th sun shall go down over the prophets, and the day shall be dark
ov them.

3:7 then shall the seer be ashamed, and the divin confounded: yea,
they shall all cover their lips; for there is no answer of god.

3:8 but truli I am full of power by the spirit of the lord, and of
judgment, and of might, to declar unto jacob hi transgression, and
to israel hi sin.

3:9 hear this, I pray you, ye head of the hous of jacob, and princes
of the hous of israel, that abhor judgment, and pervert all equity.

3:10 they build up zion with blood, and jerusalem with iniquity.

3:11 the head thereof judg for reward, and the priest thereof teach
for hire, and the prophet thereof divin for money: yet will they
lean upon the lord, and say, Is not the lord among us? none evil can
com upon us.

3:12 therefor shall zion for your sake be plow as a field, and
jerusalem shall becom heaps, and the mountain of the hous as the
high place of the forest.

4:1 but in the last day it shall come to pass, that the mountain of
th hous of the lord shall be establish in the top of the
mountains, and it shall be exalt abov the hills; and peopl shall
flow unto it.

4:2 and mani nation shall come, and say, come, and let us go up to
th mountain of the lord, and to the hous of the god of jacob; and he
wil teach us of hi ways, and we will walk in hi paths: for the law
shal go forth of zion, and the word of the lord from jerusalem.

4:3 and he shall judg among mani people, and rebuk strong nations
afar off; and they shall beat their sword into plowshares, and their
spear into pruninghooks: nation shall not lift up a sword against
nation, neither shall they learn war ani more.

4:4 but they shall sit everi man under hi vine and under hi fig
tree; and none shall make them afraid: for the mouth of the lord of
host hath spoken it.

4:5 for all peopl will walk everi one in the name of hi god, and we
wil walk in the name of the lord our god for ever and ever.

4:6 In that day, saith the lord, will I assembl her that halteth, and
i will gather her that is driven out, and her that I have afflicted;
4:7 and I will make her that halt a remnant, and her that wa cast
far off a strong nation: and the lord shall reign over them in mount
zion from henceforth, even for ever.

4:8 and thou, O tower of the flock, the strong hold of the daughter of
zion, unto thee shall it come, even the first dominion; the kingdom
shal come to the daughter of jerusalem.

4:9 now whi dost thou cri out aloud? is there no king in thee? is thy
counsellor perished? for pang have taken thee as a woman in travail.

4:10 Be in pain, and labour to bring forth, O daughter of zion, like a
woman in travail: for now shalt thou go forth out of the city, and
thou shalt dwell in the field, and thou shalt go even to babylon;
ther shalt thou be delivered; there the lord shall redeem thee from
th hand of thine enemies.

4:11 now also mani nation are gather against thee, that say, let
her be defiled, and let our eye look upon zion.

4:12 but they know not the thought of the lord, neither understand
they hi counsel: for he shall gather them as the sheav into the
floor.

4:13 aris and thresh, O daughter of zion: for I will make thine horn
iron, and I will make thi hoof brass: and thou shalt beat in pieces
mani people: and I will consecr their gain unto the lord, and their
subst unto the lord of the whole earth.

5:1 now gather thyself in troops, O daughter of troops: he hath laid
sieg against us: they shall smite the judg of israel with a rod upon
th cheek.

5:2 but thou, bethlehem ephratah, though thou be littl among the
thousand of judah, yet out of thee shall he come forth unto me that
i to be ruler in israel; whose go forth have been from of old,
from everlasting.

5:3 therefor will he give them up, until the time that she which
travaileth hath brought forth: then the remnant of hi brethren shall
return unto the children of israel.

5:4 and he shall stand and feed in the strength of the lord, in the
majesti of the name of the lord hi god; and they shall abide: for now
shal he be great unto the end of the earth.

5:5 and thi man shall be the peace, when the assyrian shall come into
our land: and when he shall tread in our palaces, then shall we raise
against him seven shepherds, and eight princip men.

5:6 and they shall wast the land of assyria with the sword, and the
land of nimrod in the entranc thereof: thu shall he deliv us from
th assyrian, when he cometh into our land, and when he treadeth
within our borders.

5:7 and the remnant of jacob shall be in the midst of mani peopl as a
dew from the lord, as the shower upon the grass, that tarrieth not
for man, nor waiteth for the son of men.

5:8 and the remnant of jacob shall be among the gentil in the midst
of mani peopl as a lion among the beast of the forest, as a young
lion among the flock of sheep: who, if he go through, both treadeth
down, and teareth in pieces, and none can deliver.

5:9 thine hand shall be lift up upon thine adversaries, and all
thin enemi shall be cut off.

5:10 and it shall come to pass in that day, saith the lord, that i
wil cut off thi hors out of the midst of thee, and I will destroy
thi chariots: 5:11 and I will cut off the citi of thi land, and
throw down all thi strong holds: 5:12 and I will cut off witchcrafts
out of thine hand; and thou shalt have no more soothsayers: 5:13 thy
graven imag also will I cut off, and thi stand imag out of the
midst of thee; and thou shalt no more worship the work of thine hands.

5:14 and I will pluck up thi grove out of the midst of thee: so will
i destroy thi cities.

5:15 and I will execut vengeanc in anger and furi upon the heathen,
such as they have not heard.

6:1 hear ye now what the lord saith; arise, contend thou befor the
mountains, and let the hill hear thi voice.

6:2 hear ye, O mountains, the lord' controversy, and ye strong
found of the earth: for the lord hath a controversi with his
people, and he will plead with israel.

6:3 O my people, what have I done unto thee? and wherein have i
weari thee? testifi against me.

6:4 for I brought thee up out of the land of egypt, and redeem thee
out of the hous of servants; and I sent befor thee moses, aaron, and
miriam.

6:5 O my people, rememb now what balak king of moab consulted, and
what balaam the son of beor answer him from shittim unto gilgal;
that ye may know the righteous of the lord.

6:6 wherewith shall I come befor the lord, and bow myself befor the
high god? shall I come befor him with burnt offerings, with calv of
a year old?  6:7 will the lord be pleas with thousand of rams, or
with ten thousand of river of oil? shall I give my firstborn for my
transgression, the fruit of my bodi for the sin of my soul?  6:8 he
hath shew thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the lord require
of thee, but to do justly, and to love mercy, and to walk humbl with
thi god?  6:9 the lord' voic crieth unto the city, and the man of
wisdom shall see thi name: hear ye the rod, and who hath appoint it.

6:10 are there yet the treasur of wicked in the hous of the
wicked, and the scant measur that is abominable?  6:11 shall I count
them pure with the wick balances, and with the bag of deceitful
weights?  6:12 for the rich men thereof are full of violence, and the
inhabit thereof have spoken lies, and their tongu is deceit in
their mouth.

6:13 therefor also will I make thee sick in smite thee, in making
the desol becaus of thi sins.

6:14 thou shalt eat, but not be satisfied; and thi cast down shall
b in the midst of thee; and thou shalt take hold, but shalt not
deliver; and that which thou deliverest will I give up to the sword.

6:15 thou shalt sow, but thou shalt not reap; thou shalt tread the
olives, but thou shalt not anoint thee with oil; and sweet wine, but
shalt not drink wine.

6:16 for the statut of omri are kept, and all the work of the house
of ahab, and ye walk in their counsels; that I should make thee a
desolation, and the inhabit thereof an hissing: therefor ye shall
bear the reproach of my people.

7:1 woe is me! for I am as when they have gather the summer fruits,
a the grapeglean of the vintage: there is no cluster to eat: my
soul desir the firstrip fruit.

7:2 the good man is perish out of the earth: and there is none
upright among men: they all lie in wait for blood; they hunt everi man
hi brother with a net.

7:3 that they may do evil with both hand earnestly, the prince
asketh, and the judg asketh for a reward; and the great man, he
uttereth hi mischiev desire: so they wrap it up.

7:4 the best of them is as a brier: the most upright is sharper than a
thorn hedge: the day of thi watchmen and thi visit cometh; now
shal be their perplexity.

7:5 trust ye not in a friend, put ye not confid in a guide: keep
th door of thi mouth from her that lieth in thi bosom.

7:6 for the son dishonoureth the father, the daughter riseth up
against her mother, the daughter in law against her mother in law; a
man' enemi are the men of hi own house.

7:7 therefor I will look unto the lord; I will wait for the god of my
salvation: my god will hear me.

7:8 rejoic not against me, O mine enemy: when I fall, I shall arise;
when I sit in darkness, the lord shall be a light unto me.

7:9 I will bear the indign of the lord, becaus I have sinned
against him, until he plead my cause, and execut judgment for me: he
wil bring me forth to the light, and I shall behold his
righteousness.

7:10 then she that is mine enemi shall see it, and shame shall cover
h which said unto me, where is the lord thi god? mine eye shall
behold her: now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the streets.

7:11 In the day that thi wall are to be built, in that day shall the
decre be far removed.

7:12 In that day also he shall come even to thee from assyria, and
from the fortifi cities, and from the fortress even to the river,
and from sea to sea, and from mountain to mountain.

7:13 notwithstand the land shall be desol becaus of them that
dwel therein, for the fruit of their doings.

7:14 feed thi peopl with thi rod, the flock of thine heritage, which
dwel solitarili in the wood, in the midst of carmel: let them feed in
bashan and gilead, as in the day of old.

7:15 accord to the day of thi come out of the land of egypt will
i shew unto him marvel things.

7:16 the nation shall see and be confound at all their might: they
shal lay their hand upon their mouth, their ear shall be deaf.

7:17 they shall lick the dust like a serpent, they shall move out of
their hole like worm of the earth: they shall be afraid of the lord
our god, and shall fear becaus of thee.

7:18 who is a god like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity, and passeth
bi the transgress of the remnant of hi heritage? he retaineth not
hi anger for ever, becaus he delighteth in mercy.

7:19 He will turn again, he will have compass upon us; he will
subdu our iniquities; and thou wilt cast all their sin into the
depth of the sea.

7:20 thou wilt perform the truth to jacob, and the merci to abraham,
which thou hast sworn unto our father from the day of old.




nahum


1:1 the burden of nineveh. the book of the vision of nahum the elkoshite.

1:2 god is jealous, and the lord revengeth; the lord revengeth, and is
furious; the lord will take vengeanc on hi adversaries, and he
reserveth wrath for hi enemies.

1:3 the lord is slow to anger, and great in power, and will not at all
acquit the wicked: the lord hath hi way in the whirlwind and in the
storm, and the cloud are the dust of hi feet.

1:4 He rebuketh the sea, and maketh it dry, and drieth up all the
rivers: bashan languisheth, and carmel, and the flower of lebanon
languisheth.

1:5 the mountain quak at him, and the hill melt, and the earth is
burn at hi presence, yea, the world, and all that dwell therein.

1:6 who can stand befor hi indignation? and who can abid in the
fierc of hi anger? hi furi is pour out like fire, and the
rock are thrown down by him.

1:7 the lord is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he
knoweth them that trust in him.

1:8 but with an overrun flood he will make an utter end of the
plac thereof, and dark shall pursu hi enemies.

1:9 what do ye imagin against the lord? he will make an utter end:
afflict shall not rise up the second time.

1:10 for while they be folden togeth as thorns, and while they are
drunken as drunkards, they shall be devour as stubbl fulli dry.

1:11 there is one come out of thee, that imagineth evil against the
lord, a wick counsellor.

1:12 thu saith the lord; though they be quiet, and likewis many, yet
thu shall they be cut down, when he shall pass through. though I have
afflict thee, I will afflict thee no more.

1:13 for now will I break hi yoke from off thee, and will burst thy
bond in sunder.

1:14 and the lord hath given a command concern thee, that no
mor of thi name be sown: out of the hous of thi god will I cut off
th graven imag and the molten image: I will make thi grave; for thou
art vile.

1:15 behold upon the mountain the feet of him that bringeth good
tidings, that publisheth peace! O judah, keep thi solemn feasts,
perform thi vows: for the wick shall no more pass through thee; he
i utterli cut off.

2:1 He that dasheth in piec is come up befor thi face: keep the
munition, watch the way, make thi loin strong, fortifi thi power
mightily.

2:2 for the lord hath turn away the excel of jacob, as the
excel of israel: for the emptier have empti them out, and
mar their vine branches.

2:3 the shield of hi mighti men is made red, the valiant men are in
scarlet: the chariot shall be with flame torch in the day of his
preparation, and the fir tree shall be terribl shaken.

2:4 the chariot shall rage in the streets, they shall justl one
against anoth in the broad ways: they shall seem like torches, they
shal run like the lightnings.

2:5 He shall recount hi worthies: they shall stumbl in their walk;
they shall make hast to the wall thereof, and the defenc shall be
prepared.

2:6 the gate of the river shall be opened, and the palac shall be
dissolved.

2:7 and huzzab shall be led away captive, she shall be brought up, and
her maid shall lead her as with the voic of doves, taber upon
their breasts.

2:8 but nineveh is of old like a pool of water: yet they shall flee
away.

stand, stand, shall they cry; but none shall look back.

2:9 take ye the spoil of silver, take the spoil of gold: for there is
non end of the store and glori out of all the pleasant furniture.

2:10 she is empty, and void, and waste: and the heart melteth, and the
kne smite together, and much pain is in all loins, and the face of
them all gather blackness.

2:11 where is the dwell of the lions, and the feedingplac of the
young lions, where the lion, even the old lion, walked, and the lion's
whelp, and none made them afraid?  2:12 the lion did tear in pieces
enough for hi whelps, and strangl for hi lionesses, and fill his
hol with prey, and hi den with ravin.

2:13 behold, I am against thee, saith the lord of hosts, and I will
burn her chariot in the smoke, and the sword shall devour thi young
lions: and I will cut off thi prey from the earth, and the voic of
thi messeng shall no more be heard.

3:1 woe to the bloodi city! it is all full of lie and robbery; the
prey departeth not; 3:2 the nois of a whip, and the nois of the
rattl of the wheels, and of the prans horses, and of the jumping
chariots.

3:3 the horseman lifteth up both the bright sword and the glittering
spear: and there is a multitud of slain, and a great number of
carcases; and there is none end of their corpses; they stumbl upon
their corpses: 3:4 becaus of the multitud of the whoredom of the
wellfavour harlot, the mistress of witchcrafts, that selleth nations
through her whoredoms, and famili through her witchcrafts.

3:5 behold, I am against thee, saith the lord of hosts; and I will
discov thi skirt upon thi face, and I will shew the nation thy
nakedness, and the kingdom thi shame.

3:6 and I will cast abomin filth upon thee, and make thee vile,
and will set thee as a gazingstock.

3:7 and it shall come to pass, that all they that look upon thee shall
fle from thee, and say, nineveh is laid waste: who will bemoan her?
whenc shall I seek comfort for thee?  3:8 art thou better than
popul no, that wa situat among the rivers, that had the waters
round about it, whose rampart wa the sea, and her wall wa from the
sea?  3:9 ethiopia and egypt were her strength, and it wa infinite;
put and lubim were thi helpers.

3:10 yet wa she carri away, she went into captivity: her young
children also were dash in piec at the top of all the streets: and
they cast lot for her honour men, and all her great men were
bound in chains.

3:11 thou also shalt be drunken: thou shalt be hid, thou also shalt
seek strength becaus of the enemy.

3:12 all thi strong hold shall be like fig tree with the firstripe
figs: if they be shaken, they shall even fall into the mouth of the
eater.

3:13 behold, thi peopl in the midst of thee are women: the gate of
thi land shall be set wide open unto thine enemies: the fire shall
devour thi bars.

3:14 draw thee water for the siege, fortifi thi strong holds: go into
clay, and tread the morter, make strong the brickkiln.

3:15 there shall the fire devour thee; the sword shall cut thee off,
it shall eat thee up like the cankerworm: make thyself mani as the
cankerworm, make thyself mani as the locusts.

3:16 thou hast multipli thi merchant abov the star of heaven: the
cankerworm spoileth, and fleeth away.

3:17 thi crown are as the locusts, and thi captain as the great
grasshoppers, which camp in the hedg in the cold day, but when the
sun ariseth they flee away, and their place is not known where they
are.

3:18 thi shepherd slumber, O king of assyria: thi nobl shall dwell
in the dust: thi peopl is scatter upon the mountains, and no man
gathereth them.

3:19 there is no heal of thi bruise; thi wound is grievous: all
that hear the bruit of thee shall clap the hand over thee: for upon
whom hath not thi wicked pass continually?




habakkuk


1:1 the burden which habakkuk the prophet did see.

1:2 O lord, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cri out
unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!  1:3 whi dost thou shew
m iniquity, and caus me to behold grievance? for spoil and
viol are befor me: and there are that rais up strife and
contention.

1:4 therefor the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth:
for the wick doth compass about the righteous; therefor wrong
judg proceedeth.

1:5 behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvelously:
for I will work a work in your day which ye will not believe, though
it be told you.

1:6 for, lo, I rais up the chaldeans, that bitter and hasti nation,
which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the
dwellingplac that are not their's.

1:7 they are terribl and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity
shal proceed of themselves.

1:8 their hors also are swifter than the leopards, and are more
fierc than the even wolves: and their horsemen shall spread
themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fli as
th eagl that hasteth to eat.

1:9 they shall come all for violence: their face shall sup up as the
east wind, and they shall gather the captiv as the sand.

1:10 and they shall scoff at the kings, and the princ shall be a
scorn unto them: they shall derid everi strong hold; for they shall
heap dust, and take it.

1:11 then shall hi mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend,
imput thi hi power unto hi god.

1:12 art thou not from everlasting, O lord my god, mine holi one? we
shal not die. O lord, thou hast ordain them for judgment; and, o
mighti god, thou hast establish them for correction.

1:13 thou art of purer eye than to behold evil, and canst not look on
iniquity: wherefor lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously,
and holdest thi tongu when the wick devoureth the man that is more
right than he?  1:14 and makest men as the fish of the sea, as
th creep things, that have no ruler over them?  1:15 they take up
al of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather
them in their drag: therefor they rejoic and are glad.

1:16 therefor they sacrific unto their net, and burn incens unto
their drag; becaus by them their portion is fat, and their meat
plenteous.

1:17 shall they therefor empti their net, and not spare continually
to slay the nations?  2:1 I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon
th tower, and will watch to see what he will say unto me, and what i
shal answer when I am reproved.

2:2 and the lord answer me, and said, write the vision, and make it
plain upon tables, that he may run that readeth it.

2:3 for the vision is yet for an appoint time, but at the end it
shal speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; becaus it
wil sure come, it will not tarry.

2:4 behold, hi soul which is lift up is not upright in him: but the
just shall live by hi faith.

2:5 yea also, becaus he transgresseth by wine, he is a proud man,
neith keepeth at home, who enlargeth hi desir as hell, and is as
death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth unto him all nations,
and heapeth unto him all people: 2:6 shall not all these take up a
par against him, and a taunt proverb against him, and say, woe
to him that increaseth that which is not his! how long? and to him
that ladeth himself with thick clay!  2:7 shall they not rise up
suddenli that shall bite thee, and awak that shall vex thee, and thou
shalt be for booti unto them?  2:8 becaus thou hast spoil many
nations, all the remnant of the peopl shall spoil thee; becaus of
men' blood, and for the violenc of the land, of the city, and of all
that dwell therein.

2:9 woe to him that coveteth an evil covet to hi house, that
h may set hi nest on high, that he may be deliv from the power
of evil!  2:10 thou hast consult shame to thi hous by cut off
mani people, and hast sin against thi soul.

2:11 for the stone shall cri out of the wall, and the beam out of the
timb shall answer it.

2:12 woe to him that buildeth a town with blood, and stablisheth a
citi by iniquity!  2:13 behold, is it not of the lord of host that
th peopl shall labour in the veri fire, and the peopl shall weary
themselv for veri vanity?  2:14 for the earth shall be fill with
th knowledg of the glori of the lord, as the water cover the sea.

2:15 woe unto him that giveth hi neighbour drink, that puttest thy
bottl to him, and makest him drunken also, that thou mayest look on
their nakedness!  2:16 thou art fill with shame for glory: drink
thou also, and let thi foreskin be uncovered: the cup of the lord's
right hand shall be turn unto thee, and shame spew shall be on
thi glory.

2:17 for the violenc of lebanon shall cover thee, and the spoil of
beasts, which made them afraid, becaus of men' blood, and for the
viol of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.

2:18 what profiteth the graven imag that the maker thereof hath
graven it; the molten image, and a teacher of lies, that the maker of
hi work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?  2:19 woe unto him that
saith to the wood, awake; to the dumb stone, arise, it shall teach!
behold, it is laid over with gold and silver, and there is no breath
at all in the midst of it.

2:20 but the lord is in hi holi temple: let all the earth keep
sil befor him.

3:1 A prayer of habakkuk the prophet upon shigionoth.

3:2 O lord, I have heard thi speech, and wa afraid: O lord, revive
thi work in the midst of the years, in the midst of the year make
known; in wrath rememb mercy.

3:3 god came from teman, and the holi one from mount paran. selah. his
glori cover the heavens, and the earth wa full of hi praise.

3:4 and hi bright wa as the light; he had horn come out of
hi hand: and there wa the hide of hi power.

3:5 befor him went the pestilence, and burn coal went forth at
hi feet.

3:6 He stood, and measur the earth: he beheld, and drove asund the
nations; and the everlast mountain were scattered, the perpetual
hil did bow: hi way are everlasting.

3:7 I saw the tent of cushan in affliction: and the curtain of the
land of midian did tremble.

3:8 wa the lord displeas against the rivers? wa thine anger
against the rivers? wa thi wrath against the sea, that thou didst
rid upon thine hors and thi chariot of salvation?  3:9 thi bow was
mad quit naked, accord to the oath of the tribes, even thi word.
selah. thou didst cleav the earth with rivers.

3:10 the mountain saw thee, and they trembled: the overflow of the
wat pass by: the deep utter hi voice, and lift up hi hands
on high.

3:11 the sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of
thin arrow they went, and at the shine of thi glitter spear.

3:12 thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst
thresh the heathen in anger.

3:13 thou wentest forth for the salvat of thi people, even for
salv with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the
hous of the wicked, by discov the foundat unto the neck.
selah.

3:14 thou didst strike through with hi stave the head of his
villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing
wa as to devour the poor secretly.

3:15 thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, through the
heap of great waters.

3:16 when I heard, my belli trembled; my lip quiver at the voice:
rotten enter into my bones, and I trembl in myself, that i
might rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people,
h will invad them with hi troops.

3:17 although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither shall fruit be
in the vines; the labour of the oliv shall fail, and the field shall
yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the fold, and there
shal be no herd in the stalls: 3:18 yet I will rejoic in the lord, i
wil joy in the god of my salvation.

3:19 the lord god is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds'
feet, and he will make me to walk upon mine high places. To the chief
sing on my string instruments.




zephaniah


1:1 the word of the lord which came unto zephaniah the son of cushi,
th son of gedaliah, the son of amariah, the son of hizkiah, in the
day of josiah the son of amon, king of judah.

1:2 I will utterli consum all thing from off the land, saith the
lord.

1:3 I will consum man and beast; I will consum the fowl of the
heaven, and the fish of the sea, and the stumbl block with the
wicked: and I will cut off man from off the land, saith the lord.

1:4 I will also stretch out mine hand upon judah, and upon all the
inhabit of jerusalem; and I will cut off the remnant of baal from
thi place, and the name of the chemarim with the priests; 1:5 and
them that worship the host of heaven upon the housetops; and them that
worship and that swear by the lord, and that swear by malcham; 1:6 and
them that are turn back from the lord; and those that have not
sought the lord, nor enquir for him.

1:7 hold thi peac at the presenc of the lord god: for the day of the
lord is at hand: for the lord hath prepar a sacrifice, he hath bid
hi guests.

1:8 and it shall come to pass in the day of the lord' sacrifice, that
i will punish the princes, and the king' children, and all such as
ar cloth with strang apparel.

1:9 In the same day also will I punish all those that leap on the
threshold, which fill their masters' hous with violenc and deceit.

1:10 and it shall come to pass in that day, saith the lord, that there
shal be the nois of a cri from the fish gate, and an howl from
th second, and a great crash from the hills.

1:11 howl, ye inhabit of maktesh, for all the merchant peopl are
cut down; all they that bear silver are cut off.

1:12 and it shall come to pass at that time, that I will search
jerusalem with candles, and punish the men that are settl on their
lees: that say in their heart, the lord will not do good, neither will
h do evil.

1:13 therefor their good shall becom a booty, and their hous a
desolation: they shall also build houses, but not inhabit them; and
they shall plant vineyards, but not drink the wine thereof.

1:14 the great day of the lord is near, it is near, and hasteth
greatly, even the voic of the day of the lord: the mighti man shall
cri there bitterly.

1:15 that day is a day of wrath, a day of troubl and distress, a day
of wast and desolation, a day of dark and gloominess, a day
of cloud and thick darkness, 1:16 A day of the trumpet and alarm
against the fenc cities, and against the high towers.

1:17 and I will bring distress upon men, that they shall walk like
blind men, becaus they have sin against the lord: and their blood
shal be pour out as dust, and their flesh as the dung.

1:18 neither their silver nor their gold shall be abl to deliv them
in the day of the lord' wrath; but the whole land shall be devoured
bi the fire of hi jealousy: for he shall make even a speedi riddance
of all them that dwell in the land.

2:1 gather yourselv together, yea, gather together, O nation not
desired; 2:2 befor the decre bring forth, befor the day pass as the
chaff, befor the fierc anger of the lord come upon you, befor the
day of the lord' anger come upon you.

2:3 seek ye the lord, all ye meek of the earth, which have wrought his
judgment; seek righteousness, seek meekness: it may be ye shall be hid
in the day of the lord' anger.

2:4 for gaza shall be forsaken, and ashkelon a desolation: they shall
driv out ashdod at the noon day, and ekron shall be root up.

2:5 woe unto the inhabit of the sea coast, the nation of the
cherethites! the word of the lord is against you; O canaan, the land
of the philistines, I will even destroy thee, that there shall be no
inhabitant.

2:6 and the sea coast shall be dwell and cottag for shepherds,
and fold for flocks.

2:7 and the coast shall be for the remnant of the hous of judah; they
shal feed thereupon: in the hous of ashkelon shall they lie down in
th evening: for the lord their god shall visit them, and turn away
their captivity.

2:8 I have heard the reproach of moab, and the revil of the
children of ammon, wherebi they have reproach my people, and
magnifi themselv against their border.

2:9 therefor as I live, saith the lord of hosts, the god of israel,
sur moab shall be as sodom, and the children of ammon as gomorrah,
even the breed of nettles, and saltpits, and a perpetual
desolation: the residu of my peopl shall spoil them, and the remnant
of my peopl shall possess them.

2:10 thi shall they have for their pride, becaus they have
reproach and magnifi themselv against the peopl of the lord of
hosts.

2:11 the lord will be terribl unto them: for he will famish all the
god of the earth; and men shall worship him, everi one from his
place, even all the isl of the heathen.

2:12 Ye ethiopian also, ye shall be slain by my sword.

2:13 and he will stretch out hi hand against the north, and destroy
assyria; and will make nineveh a desolation, and dri like a
wilderness.

2:14 and flock shall lie down in the midst of her, all the beast of
th nations: both the cormor and the bittern shall lodg in the
upp lintel of it; their voic shall sing in the windows; desolation
shal be in the thresholds; for he shall uncov the cedar work.

2:15 thi is the rejoic citi that dwelt carelessly, that said in
her heart, I am, and there is none besid me: how is she becom a
desolation, a place for beast to lie down in! everi one that passeth
bi her shall hiss, and wag hi hand.

3:1 woe to her that is filthi and polluted, to the oppress city!
3:2 she obey not the voice; she receiv not correction; she trusted
not in the lord; she drew not near to her god.

3:3 her princ within her are roar lions; her judg are evening
wolves; they gnaw not the bone till the morrow.

3:4 her prophet are light and treacher persons: her priest have
pollut the sanctuary, they have done violenc to the law.

3:5 the just lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity:
everi morn doth he bring hi judgment to light, he faileth not; but
th unjust knoweth no shame.

3:6 I have cut off the nations: their tower are desolate; I made
their street waste, that none passeth by: their citi are destroyed,
so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.

3:7 I said, sure thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receiv instruction;
so their dwell should not be cut off, howsoev I punish them:
but they rose early, and corrupt all their doings.

3:8 therefor wait ye upon me, saith the lord, until the day that i
ris up to the prey: for my determin is to gather the nations,
that I may assembl the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation,
even all my fierc anger: for all the earth shall be devour with the
fir of my jealousy.

3:9 for then will I turn to the peopl a pure language, that they may
al call upon the name of the lord, to serv him with one consent.

3:10 from beyond the river of ethiopia my suppliants, even the
daught of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

3:11 In that day shalt thou not be asham for all thi doings, wherein
th hast transgress against me: for then I will take away out of
th midst of thee them that rejoic in thi pride, and thou shalt no
mor be haughti becaus of my holi mountain.

3:12 I will also leav in the midst of thee an afflict and poor
people, and they shall trust in the name of the lord.

3:13 the remnant of israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies;
neith shall a deceit tongu be found in their mouth: for they
shal feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

3:14 sing, O daughter of zion; shout, O israel; be glad and rejoice
with all the heart, O daughter of jerusalem.

3:15 the lord hath taken away thi judgments, he hath cast out thine
enemy: the king of israel, even the lord, is in the midst of thee:
thou shalt not see evil ani more.

3:16 In that day it shall be said to jerusalem, fear thou not: and to
zion, let not thine hand be slack.

3:17 the lord thi god in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he
wil rejoic over thee with joy; he will rest in hi love, he will joy
ov thee with singing.

3:18 I will gather them that are sorrow for the solemn assembly,
who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it wa a burden.

3:19 behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and i
wil save her that halteth, and gather her that wa driven out; and i
wil get them prais and fame in everi land where they have been put
to shame.

3:20 At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that i
gath you: for I will make you a name and a prais among all people
of the earth, when I turn back your captiv befor your eyes,
saith the lord.




haggai


1:1 In the second year of dariu the king, in the sixth month, in the
first day of the month, came the word of the lord by haggai the
prophet unto zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, governor of judah, and
to joshua the son of josedech, the high priest, saying, 1:2 thus
speaketh the lord of hosts, saying, thi peopl say, the time is not
come, the time that the lord' hous should be built.

1:3 then came the word of the lord by haggai the prophet, saying, 1:4
i it time for you, O ye, to dwell in your ciel houses, and this
hous lie waste?  1:5 now therefor thu saith the lord of hosts;
consid your ways.

1:6 Ye have sown much, and bring in little; ye eat, but ye have not
enough; ye drink, but ye are not fill with drink; ye cloth you, but
ther is none warm; and he that earneth wage earneth wage to put it
into a bag with holes.

1:7 thu saith the lord of hosts; consid your ways.

1:8 Go up to the mountain, and bring wood, and build the house; and i
wil take pleasur in it, and I will be glorified, saith the lord.

1:9 Ye look for much, and, lo it came to little; and when ye brought
it home, I did blow upon it. why? saith the lord of hosts. becaus of
min hous that is waste, and ye run everi man unto hi own house.

1:10 therefor the heaven over you is stay from dew, and the earth
i stay from her fruit.

1:11 and I call for a drought upon the land, and upon the mountains,
and upon the corn, and upon the new wine, and upon the oil, and upon
that which the ground bringeth forth, and upon men, and upon cattle,
and upon all the labour of the hands.

1:12 then zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, and joshua the son of
josedech, the high priest, with all the remnant of the people, obeyed
th voic of the lord their god, and the word of haggai the prophet,
a the lord their god had sent him, and the peopl did fear befor the
lord.

1:13 then spake haggai the lord' messeng in the lord' messag unto
th people, saying, I am with you, saith the lord.

1:14 and the lord stir up the spirit of zerubbabel the son of
shealtiel, governor of judah, and the spirit of joshua the son of
josedech, the high priest, and the spirit of all the remnant of the
people; and they came and did work in the hous of the lord of hosts,
their god, 1:15 In the four and twentieth day of the sixth month, in
th second year of dariu the king.

2:1 In the seventh month, in the one and twentieth day of the month,
cam the word of the lord by the prophet haggai, saying, 2:2 speak now
to zerubbabel the son of shealtiel, governor of judah, and to joshua
th son of josedech, the high priest, and to the residu of the
people, saying, 2:3 who is left among you that saw thi hous in her
first glory? and how do ye see it now? is it not in your eye in
comparison of it as nothing?  2:4 yet now be strong, O zerubbabel,
saith the lord; and be strong, O joshua, son of josedech, the high
priest; and be strong, all ye peopl of the land, saith the lord, and
work: for I am with you, saith the lord of hosts: 2:5 accord to the
word that I coven with you when ye came out of egypt, so my
spirit remaineth among you: fear ye not.

2:6 for thu saith the lord of hosts; yet once, it is a littl while,
and I will shake the heavens, and the earth, and the sea, and the dry
land; 2:7 and I will shake all nations, and the desir of all nations
shal come: and I will fill thi hous with glory, saith the lord of
hosts.

2:8 the silver is mine, and the gold is mine, saith the lord of hosts.

2:9 the glori of thi latter hous shall be greater than of the
former, saith the lord of hosts: and in thi place will I give peace,
saith the lord of hosts.

2:10 In the four and twentieth day of the ninth month, in the second
year of darius, came the word of the lord by haggai the prophet,
saying, 2:11 thu saith the lord of hosts; ask now the priests
concern the law, saying, 2:12 If one bear holi flesh in the skirt
of hi garment, and with hi skirt do touch bread, or pottage, or
wine, or oil, or ani meat, shall it be holy? and the priest answered
and said, no.

2:13 then said haggai, If one that is unclean by a dead bodi touch any
of these, shall it be unclean? and the priest answer and said, it
shal be unclean.

2:14 then answer haggai, and said, So is thi people, and so is this
nat befor me, saith the lord; and so is everi work of their hands;
and that which they offer there is unclean.

2:15 and now, I pray you, consid from thi day and upward, from
befor a stone wa laid upon a stone in the templ of the lord: 2:16
sinc those day were, when one came to an heap of twenti measures,
ther were but ten: when one came to the pressfat for to draw out
fifti vessel out of the press, there were but twenty.

2:17 I smote you with blast and with mildew and with hail in all
th labour of your hands; yet ye turn not to me, saith the lord.

2:18 consid now from thi day and upward, from the four and
twentieth day of the ninth month, even from the day that the
found of the lord' templ wa laid, consid it.

2:19 Is the seed yet in the barn? yea, as yet the vine, and the fig
tree, and the pomegranate, and the oliv tree, hath not brought forth:
from thi day will I bless you.

2:20 and again the word of the lord came unto haggai in the four and
twentieth day of the month, saying, 2:21 speak to zerubbabel, governor
of judah, saying, I will shake the heaven and the earth; 2:22 and i
wil overthrow the throne of kingdoms, and I will destroy the strength
of the kingdom of the heathen; and I will overthrow the chariots, and
thos that ride in them; and the hors and their rider shall come
down, everi one by the sword of hi brother.

2:23 In that day, saith the lord of hosts, will I take thee, o
zerubbabel, my servant, the son of shealtiel, saith the lord, and will
mak thee as a signet: for I have chosen thee, saith the lord of hosts.




zechariah


1:1 In the eighth month, in the second year of darius, came the word
of the lord unto zechariah, the son of berechiah, the son of iddo the
prophet, saying, 1:2 the lord hath been sore displeas with your
fathers.

1:3 therefor say thou unto them, thu saith the lord of hosts; turn
y unto me, saith the lord of hosts, and I will turn unto you, saith
th lord of hosts.

1:4 Be ye not as your fathers, unto whom the former prophet have
cried, saying, thu saith the lord of hosts; turn ye now from your
evil ways, and from your evil doings: but they did not hear, nor
hearken unto me, saith the lord.

1:5 your fathers, where are they? and the prophets, do they live for
ever?  1:6 but my word and my statutes, which I command my servants
th prophets, did they not take hold of your fathers? and they
return and said, like as the lord of host thought to do unto us,
accord to our ways, and accord to our doings, so hath he dealt
with us.

1:7 upon the four and twentieth day of the eleventh month, which is
th month sebat, in the second year of darius, came the word of the
lord unto zechariah, the son of berechiah, the son of iddo the
prophet, saying, 1:8 I saw by night, and behold a man ride upon a
r horse, and he stood among the myrtl tree that were in the
bottom; and behind him were there red horses, speckled, and white.

1:9 then said I, O my lord, what are these? and the angel that talked
with me said unto me, I will shew thee what these be.

1:10 and the man that stood among the myrtl tree answer and said,
thes are they whom the lord hath sent to walk to and fro through the
earth.

1:11 and they answer the angel of the lord that stood among the
myrtl trees, and said, We have walk to and fro through the earth,
and, behold, all the earth sitteth still, and is at rest.

1:12 then the angel of the lord answer and said, O lord of hosts,
how long wilt thou not have merci on jerusalem and on the citi of
judah, against which thou hast had indign these threescor and
ten years?  1:13 and the lord answer the angel that talk with me
with good word and comfort words.

1:14 So the angel that commun with me said unto me, cri thou,
saying, thu saith the lord of hosts; I am jealou for jerusalem and
for zion with a great jealousy.

1:15 and I am veri sore displeas with the heathen that are at ease:
for I wa but a littl displeased, and they help forward the
affliction.

1:16 therefor thu saith the lord; I am return to jerusalem with
mercies: my hous shall be built in it, saith the lord of hosts, and a
lin shall be stretch forth upon jerusalem.

1:17 cri yet, saying, thu saith the lord of hosts; My citi through
prosper shall yet be spread abroad; and the lord shall yet comfort
zion, and shall yet choos jerusalem.

1:18 then lift I up mine eyes, and saw, and behold four horns.

1:19 and I said unto the angel that talk with me, what be these? and
h answer me, these are the horn which have scatter judah,
israel, and jerusalem.

1:20 and the lord shew me four carpenters.

1:21 then said I, what come these to do? and he spake, saying, these
ar the horn which have scatter judah, so that no man did lift up
hi head: but these are come to fray them, to cast out the horn of
th gentiles, which lift up their horn over the land of judah to
scatt it.

2:1 I lift up mine eye again, and looked, and behold a man with a
measur line in hi hand.

2:2 then said I, whither goest thou? and he said unto me, To measure
jerusalem, to see what is the breadth thereof, and what is the length
thereof.

2:3 and, behold, the angel that talk with me went forth, and another
angel went out to meet him, 2:4 and said unto him, run, speak to this
young man, saying, jerusalem shall be inhabit as town without walls
for the multitud of men and cattl therein: 2:5 for I, saith the
lord, will be unto her a wall of fire round about, and will be the
glori in the midst of her.

2:6 ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the north, saith the
lord: for I have spread you abroad as the four wind of the heaven,
saith the lord.

2:7 deliv thyself, O zion, that dwellest with the daughter of
babylon.

2:8 for thu saith the lord of hosts; after the glori hath he sent me
unto the nation which spoil you: for he that toucheth you toucheth
th appl of hi eye.

2:9 for, behold, I will shake mine hand upon them, and they shall be a
spoil to their servants: and ye shall know that the lord of host hath
sent me.

2:10 sing and rejoice, O daughter of zion: for, lo, I come, and I will
dwel in the midst of thee, saith the lord.

2:11 and mani nation shall be join to the lord in that day, and
shal be my people: and I will dwell in the midst of thee, and thou
shalt know that the lord of host hath sent me unto thee.

2:12 and the lord shall inherit judah hi portion in the holi land,
and shall choos jerusalem again.

2:13 Be silent, O all flesh, befor the lord: for he is rais up out
of hi holi habitation.

3:1 and he shew me joshua the high priest stand befor the angel
of the lord, and satan stand at hi right hand to resist him.

3:2 and the lord said unto satan, the lord rebuk thee, O satan; even
th lord that hath chosen jerusalem rebuk thee: is not thi a brand
pluck out of the fire?  3:3 now joshua wa cloth with filthy
garments, and stood befor the angel.

3:4 and he answer and spake unto those that stood befor him,
saying, take away the filthi garment from him. and unto him he said,
behold, I have caus thine iniqu to pass from thee, and I will
cloth thee with chang of raiment.

3:5 and I said, let them set a fair mitr upon hi head. So they set a
fair mitr upon hi head, and cloth him with garments. and the angel
of the lord stood by.

3:6 and the angel of the lord protest unto joshua, saying, 3:7 thus
saith the lord of hosts; If thou wilt walk in my ways, and if thou
wilt keep my charge, then thou shalt also judg my house, and shalt
also keep my courts, and I will give thee place to walk among these
that stand by.

3:8 hear now, O joshua the high priest, thou, and thi fellow that sit
befor thee: for they are men wonder at: for, behold, I will bring
forth my servant the branch.

3:9 for behold the stone that I have laid befor joshua; upon one
ston shall be seven eyes: behold, I will engrav the grave thereof,
saith the lord of hosts, and I will remov the iniqu of that land
in one day.

3:10 In that day, saith the lord of hosts, shall ye call everi man his
neighbour under the vine and under the fig tree.

4:1 and the angel that talk with me came again, and wake me, as a
man that is waken out of hi sleep.

4:2 and said unto me, what seest thou? and I said, I have looked, and
behold a candlestick all of gold, with a bowl upon the top of it, and
hi seven lamp thereon, and seven pipe to the seven lamps, which are
upon the top thereof: 4:3 and two oliv tree by it, one upon the
right side of the bowl, and the other upon the left side thereof.

4:4 So I answer and spake to the angel that talk with me, saying,
what are these, my lord?  4:5 then the angel that talk with me
answ and said unto me, knowest thou not what these be? and I said,
no, my lord.

4:6 then he answer and spake unto me, saying, thi is the word of
th lord unto zerubbabel, saying, not by might, nor by power, but by
mi spirit, saith the lord of hosts.

4:7 who art thou, O great mountain? befor zerubbabel thou shalt
becom a plain: and he shall bring forth the headston thereof with
shoutings, crying, grace, grace unto it.

4:8 moreov the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 4:9 the hands
of zerubbabel have laid the foundat of thi house; hi hand shall
also finish it; and thou shalt know that the lord of host hath sent
m unto you.

4:10 for who hath despis the day of small things? for they shall
rejoice, and shall see the plummet in the hand of zerubbabel with
thos seven; they are the eye of the lord, which run to and fro
through the whole earth.

4:11 then answer I, and said unto him, what are these two olive
tre upon the right side of the candlestick and upon the left side
thereof?  4:12 and I answer again, and said unto him, what be these
two oliv branch which through the two golden pipe empti the golden
oil out of themselves?  4:13 and he answer me and said, knowest thou
not what these be? and I said, no, my lord.

4:14 then said he, these are the two anoint ones, that stand by the
lord of the whole earth.

5:1 then I turned, and lift up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a
fli roll.

5:2 and he said unto me, what seest thou? and I answered, I see a
fli roll; the length thereof is twenti cubits, and the breadth
thereof ten cubits.

5:3 then said he unto me, thi is the curs that goeth forth over the
fac of the whole earth: for everi one that stealeth shall be cut off
a on thi side accord to it; and everi one that sweareth shall be
cut off as on that side accord to it.

5:4 I will bring it forth, saith the lord of hosts, and it shall enter
into the hous of the thief, and into the hous of him that sweareth
fals by my name: and it shall remain in the midst of hi house, and
shal consum it with the timber thereof and the stone thereof.

5:5 then the angel that talk with me went forth, and said unto me,
lift up now thine eyes, and see what is thi that goeth forth.

5:6 and I said, what is it? and he said, thi is an ephah that goeth
forth. He said moreover, thi is their resembl through all the
earth.

5:7 and, behold, there wa lift up a talent of lead: and thi is a
woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah.

5:8 and he said, thi is wickedness. and he cast it into the midst of
th ephah; and he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth thereof.

5:9 then lift I up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came
out two women, and the wind wa in their wings; for they had wings
lik the wing of a stork: and they lift up the ephah between the
earth and the heaven.

5:10 then said I to the angel that talk with me, whither do these
bear the ephah?  5:11 and he said unto me, To build it an hous in the
land of shinar: and it shall be established, and set there upon her
own base.

6:1 and I turned, and lift up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold,
ther came four chariot out from between two mountains; and the
mountain were mountain of brass.

6:2 In the first chariot were red horses; and in the second chariot
black horses; 6:3 and in the third chariot white horses; and in the
fourth chariot grisl and bay horses.

6:4 then I answer and said unto the angel that talk with me, what
ar these, my lord?  6:5 and the angel answer and said unto me,
thes are the four spirit of the heavens, which go forth from
stand befor the lord of all the earth.

6:6 the black hors which are therein go forth into the north
country; and the white go forth after them; and the grisl go forth
toward the south country.

6:7 and the bay went forth, and sought to go that they might walk to
and fro through the earth: and he said, get you hence, walk to and fro
through the earth. So they walk to and fro through the earth.

6:8 then cri he upon me, and spake unto me, saying, behold, these
that go toward the north countri have quiet my spirit in the north
country.

6:9 and the word of the lord came unto me, saying, 6:10 take of them
of the captivity, even of heldai, of tobijah, and of jedaiah, which
ar come from babylon, and come thou the same day, and go into the
hous of josiah the son of zephaniah; 6:11 then take silver and gold,
and make crowns, and set them upon the head of joshua the son of
josedech, the high priest; 6:12 and speak unto him, saying, thus
speaketh the lord of hosts, saying, behold the man whose name is the
branch; and he shall grow up out of hi place, and he shall build the
templ of the lord: 6:13 even he shall build the templ of the lord;
and he shall bear the glory, and shall sit and rule upon hi throne;
and he shall be a priest upon hi throne: and the counsel of peace
shal be between them both.

6:14 and the crown shall be to helem, and to tobijah, and to jedaiah,
and to hen the son of zephaniah, for a memori in the templ of the
lord.

6:15 and they that are far off shall come and build in the templ of
th lord, and ye shall know that the lord of host hath sent me unto
you. and thi shall come to pass, if ye will dilig obey the voice
of the lord your god.

7:1 and it came to pass in the fourth year of king darius, that the
word of the lord came unto zechariah in the fourth day of the ninth
month, even in chisleu; 7:2 when they had sent unto the hous of god
sherez and regemmelech, and their men, to pray befor the lord, 7:3
and to speak unto the priest which were in the hous of the lord of
hosts, and to the prophets, saying, should I weep in the fifth month,
separ myself, as I have done these so mani years?  7:4 then came
th word of the lord of host unto me, saying, 7:5 speak unto all the
