peopl of the land, and to the priests, saying, when ye fast and
mourn in the fifth and seventh month, even those seventi years, did
y at all fast unto me, even to me?  7:6 and when ye did eat, and when
y did drink, did not ye eat for yourselves, and drink for yourselves?
7:7 should ye not hear the word which the lord hath cri by the
form prophets, when jerusalem wa inhabit and in prosperity, and
th citi thereof round about her, when men inhabit the south and
th plain?  7:8 and the word of the lord came unto zechariah, saying,
7:9 thu speaketh the lord of hosts, saying, execut true judgment,
and shew merci and compass everi man to hi brother: 7:10 and
oppress not the widow, nor the fatherless, the stranger, nor the poor;
and let none of you imagin evil against hi brother in your heart.

7:11 but they refus to hearken, and pull away the shoulder, and
stop their ears, that they should not hear.

7:12 yea, they made their heart as an adam stone, lest they should
hear the law, and the word which the lord of host hath sent in his
spirit by the former prophets: therefor came a great wrath from the
lord of hosts.

7:13 therefor it is come to pass, that as he cried, and they would
not hear; so they cried, and I would not hear, saith the lord of
hosts: 7:14 but I scatter them with a whirlwind among all the
nat whom they knew not. thu the land wa desol after them,
that no man pass through nor returned: for they laid the pleasant
land desolate.

8:1 again the word of the lord of host came to me, saying, 8:2 thus
saith the lord of hosts; I wa jealou for zion with great jealousy,
and I wa jealou for her with great fury.

8:3 thu saith the lord; I am return unto zion, and will dwell in
th midst of jerusalem: and jerusalem shall be call a citi of truth;
and the mountain of the lord of host the holi mountain.

8:4 thu saith the lord of hosts; there shall yet old men and old
women dwell in the street of jerusalem, and everi man with hi staff
in hi hand for veri age.

8:5 and the street of the citi shall be full of boy and girls
play in the street thereof.

8:6 thu saith the lord of hosts; If it be marvel in the eye of
th remnant of thi peopl in these days, should it also be marvellous
in mine eyes? saith the lord of hosts.

8:7 thu saith the lord of hosts; behold, I will save my peopl from
th east country, and from the west country; 8:8 and I will bring
them, and they shall dwell in the midst of jerusalem: and they shall
b my people, and I will be their god, in truth and in righteousness.

8:9 thu saith the lord of hosts; let your hand be strong, ye that
hear in these day these word by the mouth of the prophets, which
wer in the day that the foundat of the hous of the lord of hosts
wa laid, that the templ might be built.

8:10 for befor these day there wa no hire for man, nor ani hire for
beast; neither wa there ani peac to him that went out or came in
becaus of the affliction: for I set all men everi one against his
neighbour.

8:11 but now I will not be unto the residu of thi peopl as in the
form days, saith the lord of hosts.

8:12 for the seed shall be prosperous; the vine shall give her fruit,
and the ground shall give her increase, and the heaven shall give
their dew; and I will caus the remnant of thi peopl to possess all
thes things.

8:13 and it shall come to pass, that as ye were a curs among the
heathen, O hous of judah, and hous of israel; so will I save you,
and ye shall be a blessing: fear not, but let your hand be strong.

8:14 for thu saith the lord of hosts; As I thought to punish you,
when your father provok me to wrath, saith the lord of hosts, and i
rep not: 8:15 So again have I thought in these day to do well
unto jerusalem and to the hous of judah: fear ye not.

8:16 these are the thing that ye shall do; speak ye everi man the
truth to hi neighbour; execut the judgment of truth and peac in
your gates: 8:17 and let none of you imagin evil in your hearts
against hi neighbour; and love no fals oath: for all these are
th that I hate, saith the lord.

8:18 and the word of the lord of host came unto me, saying, 8:19 thus
saith the lord of hosts; the fast of the fourth month, and the fast of
th fifth, and the fast of the seventh, and the fast of the tenth,
shal be to the hous of judah joy and gladness, and cheer feasts;
therefor love the truth and peace.

8:20 thu saith the lord of hosts; It shall yet come to pass, that
ther shall come people, and the inhabit of mani cities: 8:21 and
th inhabit of one citi shall go to another, saying, let us go
speedili to pray befor the lord, and to seek the lord of hosts: i
wil go also.

8:22 yea, mani peopl and strong nation shall come to seek the lord
of host in jerusalem, and to pray befor the lord.

8:23 thu saith the lord of hosts; In those day it shall come to
pass, that ten men shall take hold out of all languag of the
nations, even shall take hold of the skirt of him that is a jew,
saying, We will go with you: for we have heard that god is with you.

9:1 the burden of the word of the lord in the land of hadrach, and
damascu shall be the rest thereof: when the eye of man, as of all
th tribe of israel, shall be toward the lord.

9:2 and hamath also shall border thereby; tyrus, and zidon, though it
b veri wise.

9:3 and tyru did build herself a strong hold, and heap up silver as
th dust, and fine gold as the mire of the streets.

9:4 behold, the lord will cast her out, and he will smite her power in
th sea; and she shall be devour with fire.

9:5 ashkelon shall see it, and fear; gaza also shall see it, and be
veri sorrowful, and ekron; for her expect shall be ashamed; and
th king shall perish from gaza, and ashkelon shall not be inhabited.

9:6 and a bastard shall dwell in ashdod, and I will cut off the pride
of the philistines.

9:7 and I will take away hi blood out of hi mouth, and his
abomin from between hi teeth: but he that remaineth, even he,
shal be for our god, and he shall be as a governor in judah, and
ekron as a jebusite.

9:8 and I will encamp about mine hous becaus of the army, becaus of
him that passeth by, and becaus of him that returneth: and no
oppressor shall pass through them ani more: for now have I seen with
min eyes.

9:9 rejoic greatly, O daughter of zion; shout, O daughter of
jerusalem: behold, thi king cometh unto thee: he is just, and having
salvation; lowly, and ride upon an ass, and upon a colt the foal of
an ass.

9:10 and I will cut off the chariot from ephraim, and the hors from
jerusalem, and the battl bow shall be cut off: and he shall speak
peac unto the heathen: and hi dominion shall be from sea even to
sea, and from the river even to the end of the earth.

9:11 As for thee also, by the blood of thi coven I have sent forth
thi prison out of the pit wherein is no water.

9:12 turn you to the strong hold, ye prison of hope: even to day do
i declar that I will render doubl unto thee; 9:13 when I have bent
judah for me, fill the bow with ephraim, and rais up thi sons, o
zion, against thi sons, O greece, and made thee as the sword of a
mighti man.

9:14 and the lord shall be seen over them, and hi arrow shall go
forth as the lightning: and the lord god shall blow the trumpet, and
shal go with whirlwind of the south.

9:15 the lord of host shall defend them; and they shall devour, and
subdu with sling stones; and they shall drink, and make a nois as
through wine; and they shall be fill like bowls, and as the corners
of the altar.

9:16 and the lord their god shall save them in that day as the flock
of hi people: for they shall be as the stone of a crown, lift up
a an ensign upon hi land.

9:17 for how great is hi goodness, and how great is hi beauty! corn
shal make the young men cheerful, and new wine the maids.

10:1 ask ye of the lord rain in the time of the latter rain; so the
lord shall make bright clouds, and give them shower of rain, to every
on grass in the field.

10:2 for the idol have spoken vanity, and the divin have seen a
lie, and have told fals dreams; they comfort in vain: therefor they
went their way as a flock, they were troubled, becaus there wa no
shepherd.

10:3 mine anger wa kindl against the shepherds, and I punish the
goats: for the lord of host hath visit hi flock the hous of
judah, and hath made them as hi goodli hors in the battle.

10:4 out of him came forth the corner, out of him the nail, out of him
th battl bow, out of him everi oppressor together.

10:5 and they shall be as mighti men, which tread down their enemies
in the mire of the street in the battle: and they shall fight,
becaus the lord is with them, and the rider on hors shall be
confounded.

10:6 and I will strengthen the hous of judah, and I will save the
hous of joseph, and I will bring them again to place them; for I have
merci upon them: and they shall be as though I had not cast them off:
for I am the lord their god, and will hear them.

10:7 and they of ephraim shall be like a mighti man, and their heart
shal rejoic as through wine: yea, their children shall see it, and
b glad; their heart shall rejoic in the lord.

10:8 I will hiss for them, and gather them; for I have redeem them:
and they shall increas as they have increased.

10:9 and I will sow them among the people: and they shall rememb me
in far countries; and they shall live with their children, and turn
again.

10:10 I will bring them again also out of the land of egypt, and
gath them out of assyria; and I will bring them into the land of
gilead and lebanon; and place shall not be found for them.

10:11 and he shall pass through the sea with affliction, and shall
smit the wave in the sea, and all the deep of the river shall dry
up: and the pride of assyria shall be brought down, and the sceptr of
egypt shall depart away.

10:12 and I will strengthen them in the lord; and they shall walk up
and down in hi name, saith the lord.

11:1 open thi doors, O lebanon, that the fire may devour thi cedars.

11:2 howl, fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; becaus the mighti are
spoiled: howl, O ye oak of bashan; for the forest of the vintag is
com down.

11:3 there is a voic of the howl of the shepherds; for their glory
i spoiled: a voic of the roar of young lions; for the pride of
jordan is spoiled.

11:4 thu saith the lord my god; feed the flock of the slaughter; 11:5
whose possessor slay them, and hold themselv not guilty: and they
that sell them say, bless be the lord; for I am rich: and their own
shepherd piti them not.

11:6 for I will no more piti the inhabit of the land, saith the
lord: but, lo, I will deliv the men everi one into hi neighbour's
hand, and into the hand of hi king: and they shall smite the land,
and out of their hand I will not deliv them.

11:7 and I will feed the flock of slaughter, even you, O poor of the
flock. and I took unto me two staves; the one I call beauty, and the
oth I call bands; and I fed the flock.

11:8 three shepherd also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed
them, and their soul also abhor me.

11:9 then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth, let it die;
and that that is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest
eat everi one the flesh of another.

11:10 and I took my staff, even beauty, and cut it asunder, that i
might break my coven which I had made with all the people.

11:11 and it wa broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that
wait upon me knew that it wa the word of the lord.

11:12 and I said unto them, If ye think good, give me my price; and if
not, forbear. So they weigh for my price thirti piec of silver.

11:13 and the lord said unto me, cast it unto the potter: a goodly
pric that I wa prise at of them. and I took the thirti piec of
silver, and cast them to the potter in the hous of the lord.

11:14 then I cut asund mine other staff, even bands, that I might
break the brotherhood between judah and israel.

11:15 and the lord said unto me, take unto thee yet the instrument of
a foolish shepherd.

11:16 for, lo, I will rais up a shepherd in the land, which shall not
visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor
heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he
shal eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claw in pieces.

11:17 woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword shall
b upon hi arm, and upon hi right eye: hi arm shall be clean dried
up, and hi right eye shall be utterli darkened.

12:1 the burden of the word of the lord for israel, saith the lord,
which stretcheth forth the heavens, and layeth the foundat of the
earth, and formeth the spirit of man within him.

12:2 behold, I will make jerusalem a cup of trembl unto all the
peopl round about, when they shall be in the sieg both against judah
and against jerusalem.

12:3 and in that day will I make jerusalem a burdensom stone for all
people: all that burden themselv with it shall be cut in pieces,
though all the peopl of the earth be gather togeth against it.

12:4 In that day, saith the lord, I will smite everi hors with
astonishment, and hi rider with madness: and I will open mine eyes
upon the hous of judah, and will smite everi hors of the peopl with
blindness.

12:5 and the governor of judah shall say in their heart, the
inhabit of jerusalem shall be my strength in the lord of hosts
their god.

12:6 In that day will I make the governor of judah like an hearth of
fir among the wood, and like a torch of fire in a sheaf; and they
shal devour all the peopl round about, on the right hand and on the
left: and jerusalem shall be inhabit again in her own place, even in
jerusalem.

12:7 the lord also shall save the tent of judah first, that the glory
of the hous of david and the glori of the inhabit of jerusalem do
not magnifi themselv against judah.

12:8 In that day shall the lord defend the inhabit of jerusalem;
and he that is feebl among them at that day shall be as david; and
th hous of david shall be as god, as the angel of the lord before
them.

12:9 and it shall come to pass in that day, that I will seek to
destroy all the nation that come against jerusalem.

12:10 and I will pour upon the hous of david, and upon the
inhabit of jerusalem, the spirit of grace and of supplications:
and they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, and they shall
mourn for him, as one mourneth for hi onli son, and shall be in
bitt for him, as one that is in bitter for hi firstborn.

12:11 In that day shall there be a great mourn in jerusalem, as the
mourn of hadadrimmon in the valley of megiddon.

12:12 and the land shall mourn, everi famili apart; the famili of the
hous of david apart, and their wive apart; the famili of the house
of nathan apart, and their wive apart; 12:13 the famili of the house
of levi apart, and their wive apart; the famili of shimei apart, and
their wive apart; 12:14 all the famili that remain, everi family
apart, and their wive apart.

13:1 In that day there shall be a fountain open to the hous of
david and to the inhabit of jerusalem for sin and for uncleanness.

13:2 and it shall come to pass in that day, saith the lord of hosts,
that I will cut off the name of the idol out of the land, and they
shal no more be remembered: and also I will caus the prophet and
th unclean spirit to pass out of the land.

13:3 and it shall come to pass, that when ani shall yet prophesy, then
hi father and hi mother that begat him shall say unto him, thou
shalt not live; for thou speakest lie in the name of the lord: and
hi father and hi mother that begat him shall thrust him through when
h prophesieth.

13:4 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the prophet shall be
asham everi one of hi vision, when he hath prophesied; neither
shal they wear a rough garment to deceive: 13:5 but he shall say, i
am no prophet, I am an husbandman; for man taught me to keep cattle
from my youth.

13:6 and one shall say unto him, what are these wound in thine hands?
then he shall answer, those with which I wa wound in the hous of
mi friends.

13:7 awake, O sword, against my shepherd, and against the man that is
mi fellow, saith the lord of hosts: smite the shepherd, and the sheep
shal be scattered: and I will turn mine hand upon the littl ones.

13:8 and it shall come to pass, that in all the land, saith the lord,
two part therein shall be cut off and die; but the third shall be
left therein.

13:9 and I will bring the third part through the fire, and will refine
them as silver is refined, and will tri them as gold is tried: they
shal call on my name, and I will hear them: I will say, It is my
people: and they shall say, the lord is my god.

14:1 behold, the day of the lord cometh, and thi spoil shall be
divid in the midst of thee.

14:2 for I will gather all nation against jerusalem to battle; and
th citi shall be taken, and the hous rifled, and the women
ravished; and half of the citi shall go forth into captivity, and the
residu of the peopl shall not be cut off from the city.

14:3 then shall the lord go forth, and fight against those nations, as
when he fought in the day of battle.

14:4 and hi feet shall stand in that day upon the mount of olives,
which is befor jerusalem on the east, and the mount of oliv shall
cleav in the midst thereof toward the east and toward the west, and
ther shall be a veri great valley; and half of the mountain shall
remov toward the north, and half of it toward the south.

14:5 and ye shall flee to the valley of the mountains; for the valley
of the mountain shall reach unto azal: yea, ye shall flee, like as ye
fl from befor the earthquak in the day of uzziah king of judah:
and the lord my god shall come, and all the saint with thee.

14:6 and it shall come to pass in that day, that the light shall not
b clear, nor dark: 14:7 but it shall be one day which shall be known
to the lord, not day, nor night: but it shall come to pass, that at
even time it shall be light.

14:8 and it shall be in that day, that live water shall go out from
jerusalem; half of them toward the former sea, and half of them toward
th hinder sea: in summer and in winter shall it be.

14:9 and the lord shall be king over all the earth: in that day shall
ther be one lord, and hi name one.

14:10 all the land shall be turn as a plain from geba to rimmon
south of jerusalem: and it shall be lift up, and inhabit in her
place, from benjamin' gate unto the place of the first gate, unto the
corn gate, and from the tower of hananeel unto the king's
winepresses.

14:11 and men shall dwell in it, and there shall be no more utter
destruction; but jerusalem shall be safe inhabited.

14:12 and thi shall be the plagu wherewith the lord will smite all
th peopl that have fought against jerusalem; their flesh shall
consum away while they stand upon their feet, and their eye shall
consum away in their holes, and their tongu shall consum away in
their mouth.

14:13 and it shall come to pass in that day, that a great tumult from
th lord shall be among them; and they shall lay hold everi one on the
hand of hi neighbour, and hi hand shall rise up against the hand of
hi neighbour.

14:14 and judah also shall fight at jerusalem; and the wealth of all
th heathen round about shall be gather together, gold, and silver,
and apparel, in great abundance.

14:15 and so shall be the plagu of the horse, of the mule, of the
camel, and of the ass, and of all the beast that shall be in these
tents, as thi plague.

14:16 and it shall come to pass, that everi one that is left of all
th nation which came against jerusalem shall even go up from year to
year to worship the king, the lord of hosts, and to keep the feast of
tabernacles.

14:17 and it shall be, that whoso will not come up of all the families
of the earth unto jerusalem to worship the king, the lord of hosts,
even upon them shall be no rain.

14:18 and if the famili of egypt go not up, and come not, that have no
rain; there shall be the plague, wherewith the lord will smite the
heathen that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.

14:19 thi shall be the punish of egypt, and the punish of all
nat that come not up to keep the feast of tabernacles.

14:20 In that day shall there be upon the bell of the horses,
holi unto the lord; and the pot in the lord' hous shall be like
th bowl befor the altar.

14:21 yea, everi pot in jerusalem and in judah shall be holi unto
th lord of hosts: and all they that sacrific shall come and take of
them, and seeth therein: and in that day there shall be no more the
canaanit in the hous of the lord of hosts.




malachi


1:1 the burden of the word of the lord to israel by malachi.

1:2 I have love you, saith the lord. yet ye say, wherein hast thou
lov us? wa not esau jacob' brother? saith the lord: yet I loved
jacob, 1:3 and I hate esau, and laid hi mountain and hi heritage
wast for the dragon of the wilderness.

1:4 wherea edom saith, We are impoverished, but we will return and
build the desol places; thu saith the lord of hosts, they shall
build, but I will throw down; and they shall call them, the border of
wickedness, and, the peopl against whom the lord hath indign for
ever.

1:5 and your eye shall see, and ye shall say, the lord will be
magnifi from the border of israel.

1:6 A son honoureth hi father, and a servant hi master: if then I be
a father, where is mine honour? and if I be a master, where is my
fear? saith the lord of host unto you, O priests, that despis my
name. and ye say, wherein have we despis thi name?  1:7 Ye offer
pollut bread upon mine altar; and ye say, wherein have we polluted
thee? In that ye say, the tabl of the lord is contemptible.

1:8 and if ye offer the blind for sacrifice, is it not evil? and if ye
off the lame and sick, is it not evil? offer it now unto thy
governor; will he be pleas with thee, or accept thi person? saith
th lord of hosts.

1:9 and now, I pray you, beseech god that he will be graciou unto us:
thi hath been by your means: will he regard your persons? saith the
lord of hosts.

1:10 who is there even among you that would shut the door for nought?
neith do ye kindl fire on mine altar for nought. I have no pleasure
in you, saith the lord of hosts, neither will I accept an offer at
your hand.

1:11 for from the rise of the sun even unto the go down of the
sam my name shall be great among the gentiles; and in everi place
incens shall be offer unto my name, and a pure offering: for my
nam shall be great among the heathen, saith the lord of hosts.

1:12 but ye have profan it, in that ye say, the tabl of the lord is
polluted; and the fruit thereof, even hi meat, is contemptible.

1:13 Ye said also, behold, what a weari is it! and ye have snuffed
at it, saith the lord of hosts; and ye brought that which wa torn,
and the lame, and the sick; thu ye brought an offering: should i
accept thi of your hand? saith the lord.

1:14 but curs be the deceiver, which hath in hi flock a male, and
voweth, and sacrificeth unto the lord a corrupt thing: for I am a
great king, saith the lord of hosts, and my name is dread among the
heathen.

2:1 and now, O ye priests, thi command is for you.

2:2 If ye will not hear, and if ye will not lay it to heart, to give
glori unto my name, saith the lord of hosts, I will even send a curse
upon you, and I will curs your blessings: yea, I have curs them
already, becaus ye do not lay it to heart.

2:3 behold, I will corrupt your seed, and spread dung upon your faces,
even the dung of your solemn feasts; and one shall take you away with
it.

2:4 and ye shall know that I have sent thi command unto you, that
mi coven might be with levi, saith the lord of hosts.

2:5 My coven wa with him of life and peace; and I gave them to him
for the fear wherewith he fear me, and wa afraid befor my name.

2:6 the law of truth wa in hi mouth, and iniqu wa not found in
hi lips: he walk with me in peac and equity, and did turn many
away from iniquity.

2:7 for the priest' lip should keep knowledge, and they should seek
th law at hi mouth: for he is the messeng of the lord of hosts.

2:8 but ye are depart out of the way; ye have caus mani to stumble
at the law; ye have corrupt the coven of levi, saith the lord of
hosts.

2:9 therefor have I also made you contempt and base befor all
th people, accord as ye have not kept my ways, but have been
parti in the law.

2:10 have we not all one father? hath not one god creat us? whi do
w deal treacher everi man against hi brother, by profan the
coven of our fathers?  2:11 judah hath dealt treacherously, and an
abomin is commit in israel and in jerusalem; for judah hath
profan the holi of the lord which he loved, and hath marri the
daught of a strang god.

2:12 the lord will cut off the man that doeth this, the master and the
scholar, out of the tabernacl of jacob, and him that offereth an
off unto the lord of hosts.

2:13 and thi have ye done again, cover the altar of the lord with
tears, with weeping, and with cri out, insomuch that he regardeth
not the offer ani more, or receiveth it with good will at your
hand.

2:14 yet ye say, wherefore? becaus the lord hath been wit between
the and the wife of thi youth, against whom thou hast dealt
treacherously: yet is she thi companion, and the wife of thi covenant.

2:15 and did not he make one? yet had he the residu of the spirit.
and wherefor one? that he might seek a godli seed. therefor take
he to your spirit, and let none deal treacher against the wife
of hi youth.

2:16 for the lord, the god of israel, saith that he hateth putting
away: for one covereth violenc with hi garment, saith the lord of
hosts: therefor take heed to your spirit, that ye deal not
treacherously.

2:17 Ye have weari the lord with your words. yet ye say, wherein
hav we weari him? when ye say, everi one that doeth evil is good in
th sight of the lord, and he delighteth in them; or, where is the god
of judgment?  3:1 behold, I will send my messenger, and he shall
prepar the way befor me: and the lord, whom ye seek, shall suddenly
com to hi temple, even the messeng of the covenant, whom ye
delight in: behold, he shall come, saith the lord of hosts.

3:2 but who may abid the day of hi coming? and who shall stand when
h appeareth? for he is like a refiner' fire, and like fullers' soap:
3:3 and he shall sit as a refin and purifi of silver: and he shall
purifi the son of levi, and purg them as gold and silver, that they
may offer unto the lord an offer in righteousness.

3:4 then shall the offer of judah and jerusalem be pleasant unto
th lord, as in the day of old, and as in former years.

3:5 and I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift
wit against the sorcerers, and against the adulterers, and against
fals swearers, and against those that oppress the hirel in his
wages, the widow, and the fatherless, and that turn asid the stranger
from hi right, and fear not me, saith the lord of hosts.

3:6 for I am the lord, I chang not; therefor ye son of jacob are
not consumed.

3:7 even from the day of your father ye are gone away from mine
ordinances, and have not kept them. return unto me, and I will return
unto you, saith the lord of hosts. but ye said, wherein shall we
return?  3:8 will a man rob god? yet ye have rob me. but ye say,
wherein have we rob thee? In tith and offerings.

3:9 Ye are curs with a curse: for ye have rob me, even thi whole
nation.

3:10 bring ye all the tith into the storehouse, that there may be
meat in mine house, and prove me now herewith, saith the lord of
hosts, if I will not open you the window of heaven, and pour you out
a blessing, that there shall not be room enough to receiv it.

3:11 and I will rebuk the devour for your sakes, and he shall not
destroy the fruit of your ground; neither shall your vine cast her
fruit befor the time in the field, saith the lord of hosts.

3:12 and all nation shall call you blessed: for ye shall be a
delightsom land, saith the lord of hosts.

3:13 your word have been stout against me, saith the lord. yet ye
say, what have we spoken so much against thee?  3:14 Ye have said, it
i vain to serv god: and what profit is it that we have kept his
ordinance, and that we have walk mourn befor the lord of
hosts?  3:15 and now we call the proud happy; yea, they that work
wicked are set up; yea, they that tempt god are even delivered.

3:16 then they that fear the lord spake often one to another: and
th lord hearkened, and heard it, and a book of remembr was
written befor him for them that fear the lord, and that thought
upon hi name.

3:17 and they shall be mine, saith the lord of hosts, in that day when
i make up my jewels; and I will spare them, as a man spareth hi own
son that serveth him.

3:18 then shall ye return, and discern between the righteou and the
wicked, between him that serveth god and him that serveth him not.

4:1 for, behold, the day cometh, that shall burn as an oven; and all
th proud, yea, and all that do wickedly, shall be stubble: and the
day that cometh shall burn them up, saith the lord of hosts, that it
shal leav them neither root nor branch.

4:2 but unto you that fear my name shall the sun of righteousness
aris with heal in hi wings; and ye shall go forth, and grow up as
calv of the stall.

4:3 and ye shall tread down the wicked; for they shall be ash under
th sole of your feet in the day that I shall do this, saith the lord
of hosts.

4:4 rememb ye the law of mose my servant, which I command unto
him in horeb for all israel, with the statut and judgments.

4:5 behold, I will send you elijah the prophet befor the come of
th great and dread day of the lord: 4:6 and he shall turn the
heart of the father to the children, and the heart of the children to
their fathers, lest I come and smite the earth with a curse.


***




th new testament of the king jame bible




th gospel accord to saint matthew


1:1 the book of the gener of jesu christ, the son of david, the
son of abraham.

1:2 abraham begat isaac; and isaac begat jacob; and jacob begat judas
and hi brethren; 1:3 and juda begat phare and zara of thamar; and
phar begat esrom; and esrom begat aram; 1:4 and aram begat aminadab;
and aminadab begat naasson; and naasson begat salmon; 1:5 and salmon
begat booz of rachab; and booz begat obe of ruth; and obe begat
jesse; 1:6 and jess begat david the king; and david the king begat
solomon of her that had been the wife of urias; 1:7 and solomon begat
roboam; and roboam begat abia; and abia begat asa; 1:8 and asa begat
josaphat; and josaphat begat joram; and joram begat ozias; 1:9 and
ozia begat joatham; and joatham begat achaz; and achaz begat ezekias;
1:10 and ezekia begat manasses; and manass begat amon; and amon
begat josias; 1:11 and josia begat jechonia and hi brethren, about
th time they were carri away to babylon: 1:12 and after they were
brought to babylon, jechonia begat salathiel; and salathiel begat
zorobabel; 1:13 and zorobabel begat abiud; and abiud begat eliakim;
and eliakim begat azor; 1:14 and azor begat sadoc; and sadoc begat
achim; and achim begat eliud; 1:15 and eliud begat eleazar; and
eleazar begat matthan; and matthan begat jacob; 1:16 and jacob begat
joseph the husband of mary, of whom wa born jesus, who is called
christ.

1:17 So all the gener from abraham to david are fourteen
generations; and from david until the carri away into babylon are
fourteen generations; and from the carri away into babylon unto
christ are fourteen generations.

1:18 now the birth of jesu christ wa on thi wise: when as his
moth mari wa espous to joseph, befor they came together, she was
found with child of the holi ghost.

1:19 then joseph her husband, be a just man, and not will to
mak her a publick example, wa mind to put her away privily.

1:20 but while he thought on these things, behold, the angel of the
lord appear unto him in a dream, saying, joseph, thou son of david,
fear not to take unto thee mari thi wife: for that which is conceived
in her is of the holi ghost.

1:21 and she shall bring forth a son, and thou shalt call hi name
jesus: for he shall save hi peopl from their sins.

1:22 now all thi wa done, that it might be fulfil which was
spoken of the lord by the prophet, saying, 1:23 behold, a virgin shall
b with child, and shall bring forth a son, and they shall call his
nam emmanuel, which be interpret is, god with us.

1:24 then joseph be rais from sleep did as the angel of the lord
had bidden him, and took unto him hi wife: 1:25 and knew her not till
sh had brought forth her firstborn son: and he call hi name jesus.

2:1 now when jesu wa born in bethlehem of judaea in the day of
herod the king, behold, there came wise men from the east to
jerusalem, 2:2 saying, where is he that is born king of the jews? for
w have seen hi star in the east, and are come to worship him.

2:3 when herod the king had heard these things, he wa troubled, and
al jerusalem with him.

2:4 and when he had gather all the chief priest and scribe of the
peopl together, he demand of them where christ should be born.

2:5 and they said unto him, In bethlehem of judaea: for thu it is
written by the prophet, 2:6 and thou bethlehem, in the land of juda,
art not the least among the princ of juda: for out of thee shall
com a governor, that shall rule my peopl israel.

2:7 then herod, when he had privili call the wise men, enquir of
them dilig what time the star appeared.

2:8 and he sent them to bethlehem, and said, Go and search diligently
for the young child; and when ye have found him, bring me word again,
that I may come and worship him also.

2:9 when they had heard the king, they departed; and, lo, the star,
which they saw in the east, went befor them, till it came and stood
ov where the young child was.

2:10 when they saw the star, they rejoic with exceed great joy.

2:11 and when they were come into the house, they saw the young child
with mari hi mother, and fell down, and worship him: and when they
had open their treasures, they present unto him gifts; gold, and
frankincens and myrrh.

2:12 and be warn of god in a dream that they should not return to
herod, they depart into their own countri anoth way.

2:13 and when they were departed, behold, the angel of the lord
appeareth to joseph in a dream, saying, arise, and take the young
child and hi mother, and flee into egypt, and be thou there until i
br thee word: for herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

2:14 when he arose, he took the young child and hi mother by night,
and depart into egypt: 2:15 and wa there until the death of herod:
that it might be fulfil which wa spoken of the lord by the
prophet, saying, out of egypt have I call my son.

2:16 then herod, when he saw that he wa mock of the wise men, was
exceed wroth, and sent forth, and slew all the children that were
in bethlehem, and in all the coast thereof, from two year old and
under, accord to the time which he had dilig enquir of the
wis men.

2:17 then wa fulfil that which wa spoken by jeremi the prophet,
saying, 2:18 In rama wa there a voic heard, lamentation, and
weeping, and great mourning, rachel weep for her children, and
would not be comforted, becaus they are not.

2:19 but when herod wa dead, behold, an angel of the lord appeareth
in a dream to joseph in egypt, 2:20 saying, arise, and take the young
child and hi mother, and go into the land of israel: for they are
dead which sought the young child' life.

2:21 and he arose, and took the young child and hi mother, and came
into the land of israel.

2:22 but when he heard that archelau did reign in judaea in the room
of hi father herod, he wa afraid to go thither: notwithstanding,
b warn of god in a dream, he turn asid into the part of
galilee: 2:23 and he came and dwelt in a citi call nazareth: that it
might be fulfil which wa spoken by the prophets, He shall be
cal a nazarene.

3:1 In those day came john the baptist, preach in the wilderness
of judaea, 3:2 and saying, repent ye: for the kingdom of heaven is at
hand.

3:3 for thi is he that wa spoken of by the prophet esaias, saying,
th voic of one cri in the wilderness, prepar ye the way of the
lord, make hi path straight.

3:4 and the same john had hi raiment of camel' hair, and a leathern
girdl about hi loins; and hi meat wa locust and wild honey.

3:5 then went out to him jerusalem, and all judaea, and all the region
round about jordan, 3:6 and were baptiz of him in jordan, confessing
their sins.

3:7 but when he saw mani of the pharise and sadduce come to his
baptism, he said unto them, O gener of vipers, who hath warned
y to flee from the wrath to come?  3:8 bring forth therefor fruits
meet for repentance: 3:9 and think not to say within yourselves, we
hav abraham to our father: for I say unto you, that god is abl of
thes stone to rais up children unto abraham.

3:10 and now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees:
therefor everi tree which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down,
and cast into the fire.

3:11 I inde baptiz you with water unto repentance. but he that
cometh after me is mightier than I, whose shoe I am not worthi to
bear: he shall baptiz you with the holi ghost, and with fire: 3:12
whose fan is in hi hand, and he will throughli purg hi floor, and
gath hi wheat into the garner; but he will burn up the chaff with
unquench fire.

3:13 then cometh jesu from galile to jordan unto john, to be
bapt of him.

3:14 but john forbad him, saying, I have need to be baptiz of thee,
and comest thou to me?  3:15 and jesu answer said unto him, suffer
it to be so now: for thu it becometh us to fulfil all righteousness.
then he suffer him.

3:16 and jesus, when he wa baptized, went up straightway out of the
water: and, lo, the heaven were open unto him, and he saw the
spirit of god descend like a dove, and light upon him: 3:17 and
lo a voic from heaven, saying, thi is my belov son, in whom I am
wel pleased.

4:1 then wa jesu led up of the spirit into the wilder to be
tempt of the devil.

4:2 and when he had fast forti day and forti nights, he was
afterward an hungred.

4:3 and when the tempter came to him, he said, If thou be the son of
god, command that these stone be made bread.

4:4 but he answer and said, It is written, man shall not live by
bread alone, but by everi word that proceedeth out of the mouth of
god.

4:5 then the devil taketh him up into the holi city, and setteth him
on a pinnacl of the temple, 4:6 and saith unto him, If thou be the
son of god, cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his
angel charg concern thee: and in their hand they shall bear thee
up, lest at ani time thou dash thi foot against a stone.

4:7 jesu said unto him, It is written again, thou shalt not tempt the
lord thi god.

4:8 again, the devil taketh him up into an exceed high mountain,
and sheweth him all the kingdom of the world, and the glori of them;
4:9 and saith unto him, all these thing will I give thee, if thou
wilt fall down and worship me.

4:10 then saith jesu unto him, get thee hence, satan: for it is
written, thou shalt worship the lord thi god, and him onli shalt thou
serve.

4:11 then the devil leaveth him, and, behold, angel came and
minist unto him.

4:12 now when jesu had heard that john wa cast into prison, he
depart into galilee; 4:13 and leav nazareth, he came and dwelt in
capernaum, which is upon the sea coast, in the border of zabulon and
nephthalim: 4:14 that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by esaias
th prophet, saying, 4:15 the land of zabulon, and the land of
nephthalim, by the way of the sea, beyond jordan, galile of the
gentiles; 4:16 the peopl which sat in dark saw great light; and
to them which sat in the region and shadow of death light is sprung
up.

4:17 from that time jesu began to preach, and to say, repent: for the
kingdom of heaven is at hand.

4:18 and jesus, walk by the sea of galilee, saw two brethren, simon
cal peter, and andrew hi brother, cast a net into the sea: for
they were fishers.

4:19 and he saith unto them, follow me, and I will make you fisher of
men.

4:20 and they straightway left their nets, and follow him.

4:21 and go on from thence, he saw other two brethren, jame the
son of zebedee, and john hi brother, in a ship with zebede their
father, mend their nets; and he call them.

4:22 and they immedi left the ship and their father, and followed
him.

4:23 and jesu went about all galilee, teach in their synagogues,
and preach the gospel of the kingdom, and heal all manner of
sick and all manner of diseas among the people.

4:24 and hi fame went throughout all syria: and they brought unto him
al sick peopl that were taken with diver diseas and torments, and
thos which were possess with devils, and those which were lunatick,
and those that had the palsy; and he heal them.

4:25 and there follow him great multitud of peopl from galilee,
and from decapolis, and from jerusalem, and from judaea, and from
beyond jordan.

5:1 and see the multitudes, he went up into a mountain: and when he
wa set, hi discipl came unto him: 5:2 and he open hi mouth, and
taught them, saying, 5:3 bless are the poor in spirit: for their is
th kingdom of heaven.

5:4 bless are they that mourn: for they shall be comforted.

5:5 bless are the meek: for they shall inherit the earth.

5:6 bless are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness:
for they shall be filled.

5:7 bless are the merciful: for they shall obtain mercy.

5:8 bless are the pure in heart: for they shall see god.

5:9 bless are the peacemakers: for they shall be call the children
of god.

5:10 bless are they which are persecut for righteousness' sake:
for their is the kingdom of heaven.

5:11 bless are ye, when men shall revil you, and persecut you, and
shal say all manner of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

5:12 rejoice, and be exceed glad: for great is your reward in
heaven: for so persecut they the prophet which were befor you.

5:13 Ye are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his
savour, wherewith shall it be salted? it is thenceforth good for
nothing, but to be cast out, and to be trodden under foot of men.

5:14 Ye are the light of the world. A citi that is set on an hill
cannot be hid.

5:15 neither do men light a candle, and put it under a bushel, but on
a candlestick; and it giveth light unto all that are in the house.

5:16 let your light so shine befor men, that they may see your good
works, and glorifi your father which is in heaven.

5:17 think not that I am come to destroy the law, or the prophets: i
am not come to destroy, but to fulfil.

5:18 for verili I say unto you, till heaven and earth pass, one jot or
on tittl shall in no wise pass from the law, till all be fulfilled.

5:19 whosoev therefor shall break one of these least commandments,
and shall teach men so, he shall be call the least in the kingdom of
heaven: but whosoev shall do and teach them, the same shall be
cal great in the kingdom of heaven.

5:20 for I say unto you, that except your righteous shall exceed
th righteous of the scribe and pharisees, ye shall in no case
ent into the kingdom of heaven.

5:21 Ye have heard that it wa said by them of old time, thou shalt
not kill; and whosoev shall kill shall be in danger of the judgment:
5:22 but I say unto you, that whosoev is angri with hi brother
without a caus shall be in danger of the judgment: and whosoever
shal say to hi brother, raca, shall be in danger of the council: but
whosoev shall say, thou fool, shall be in danger of hell fire.

5:23 therefor if thou bring thi gift to the altar, and there
rememberest that thi brother hath ought against thee; 5:24 leav there
thi gift befor the altar, and go thi way; first be reconcil to thy
brother, and then come and offer thi gift.

5:25 agre with thine adversari quickly, while thou art in the way
with him; lest at ani time the adversari deliv thee to the judge,
and the judg deliv thee to the officer, and thou be cast into
prison.

5:26 verili I say unto thee, thou shalt by no mean come out thence,
til thou hast paid the uttermost farthing.

5:27 Ye have heard that it wa said by them of old time, thou shalt
not commit adultery: 5:28 but I say unto you, that whosoev looketh
on a woman to lust after her hath commit adulteri with her already
in hi heart.

5:29 and if thi right eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from
thee: for it is profit for thee that one of thi member should
perish, and not that thi whole bodi should be cast into hell.

5:30 and if thi right hand offend thee, cut it off, and cast it from
thee: for it is profit for thee that one of thi member should
perish, and not that thi whole bodi should be cast into hell.

5:31 It hath been said, whosoev shall put away hi wife, let him
giv her a write of divorcement: 5:32 but I say unto you, that
whosoev shall put away hi wife, save for the caus of
fornication, causeth her to commit adultery: and whosoev shall marry
h that is divorc committeth adultery.

5:33 again, ye have heard that it hath been said by them of old time,
th shalt not forswear thyself, but shalt perform unto the lord thine
oaths: 5:34 but I say unto you, swear not at all; neither by heaven;
for it is god' throne: 5:35 nor by the earth; for it is his
footstool: neither by jerusalem; for it is the citi of the great king.

5:36 neither shalt thou swear by thi head, becaus thou canst not make
on hair white or black.

5:37 but let your commun be, yea, yea; nay, nay: for whatsoever
i more than these cometh of evil.

5:38 Ye have heard that it hath been said, An eye for an eye, and a
tooth for a tooth: 5:39 but I say unto you, that ye resist not evil:
but whosoev shall smite thee on thi right cheek, turn to him the
oth also.

5:40 and if ani man will sue thee at the law, and take away thi coat,
let him have thi cloak also.

5:41 and whosoev shall compel thee to go a mile, go with him twain.

5:42 give to him that asketh thee, and from him that would borrow of
the turn not thou away.

5:43 Ye have heard that it hath been said, thou shalt love thy
neighbour, and hate thine enemy.

5:44 but I say unto you, love your enemies, bless them that curs you,
do good to them that hate you, and pray for them which despitefully
us you, and persecut you; 5:45 that ye may be the children of your
fath which is in heaven: for he maketh hi sun to rise on the evil
and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust.

5:46 for if ye love them which love you, what reward have ye? do not
even the publican the same?  5:47 and if ye salut your brethren
only, what do ye more than others? do not even the publican so?  5:48
be ye therefor perfect, even as your father which is in heaven is
perfect.

6:1 take heed that ye do not your alm befor men, to be seen of them:
otherwis ye have no reward of your father which is in heaven.

6:2 therefor when thou doest thine alms, do not sound a trumpet
befor thee, as the hypocrit do in the synagogu and in the
streets, that they may have glori of men. verili I say unto you, they
hav their reward.

6:3 but when thou doest alms, let not thi left hand know what thy
right hand doeth: 6:4 that thine alm may be in secret: and thi father
which seeth in secret himself shall reward thee openly.

6:5 and when thou prayest, thou shalt not be as the hypocrit are:
for they love to pray stand in the synagogu and in the corner of
th streets, that they may be seen of men. verili I say unto you, they
hav their reward.

6:6 but thou, when thou prayest, enter into thi closet, and when thou
hast shut thi door, pray to thi father which is in secret; and thy
fath which seeth in secret shall reward thee openly.

6:7 but when ye pray, use not vain repetitions, as the heathen do: for
they think that they shall be heard for their much speaking.

6:8 Be not ye therefor like unto them: for your father knoweth what
th ye have need of, befor ye ask him.

6:9 after thi manner therefor pray ye: our father which art in
heaven, hallow be thi name.

6:10 thi kingdom come, thi will be done in earth, as it is in heaven.

6:11 give us thi day our daili bread.

6:12 and forgiv us our debts, as we forgiv our debtors.

6:13 and lead us not into temptation, but deliv us from evil: for
thin is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. amen.

6:14 for if ye forgiv men their trespasses, your heavenli father will
also forgiv you: 6:15 but if ye forgiv not men their trespasses,
neith will your father forgiv your trespasses.

6:16 moreov when ye fast, be not, as the hypocrites, of a sad
countenance: for they disfigur their faces, that they may appear unto
men to fast. verili I say unto you, they have their reward.

6:17 but thou, when thou fastest, anoint thine head, and wash thy
face; 6:18 that thou appear not unto men to fast, but unto thi father
which is in secret: and thi father, which seeth in secret, shall
reward thee openly.

6:19 lay not up for yourselv treasur upon earth, where moth and
rust doth corrupt, and where thiev break through and steal: 6:20 but
lay up for yourselv treasur in heaven, where neither moth nor rust
doth corrupt, and where thiev do not break through nor steal: 6:21
for where your treasur is, there will your heart be also.

6:22 the light of the bodi is the eye: if therefor thine eye be
single, thi whole bodi shall be full of light.

6:23 but if thine eye be evil, thi whole bodi shall be full of
darkness.

if therefor the light that is in thee be darkness, how great is that
darkness!  6:24 No man can serv two masters: for either he will hate
th one, and love the other; or els he will hold to the one, and
despis the other. Ye cannot serv god and mammon.

6:25 therefor I say unto you, take no thought for your life, what ye
shal eat, or what ye shall drink; nor yet for your body, what ye
shal put on. Is not the life more than meat, and the bodi than
raiment?  6:26 behold the fowl of the air: for they sow not, neither
do they reap, nor gather into barns; yet your heavenli father feedeth
them. are ye not much better than they?  6:27 which of you by taking
thought can add one cubit unto hi stature?  6:28 and whi take ye
thought for raiment? consid the lili of the field, how they grow;
they toil not, neither do they spin: 6:29 and yet I say unto you, that
even solomon in all hi glori wa not array like one of these.

6:30 wherefore, if god so cloth the grass of the field, which to day
is, and to morrow is cast into the oven, shall he not much more clothe
you, O ye of littl faith?  6:31 therefor take no thought, saying,
what shall we eat? or, what shall we drink? or, wherewith shall we
b clothed?  6:32 (for after all these thing do the gentil seek:)
for your heavenli father knoweth that ye have need of all these
things.

6:33 but seek ye first the kingdom of god, and hi righteousness; and
al these thing shall be ad unto you.

6:34 take therefor no thought for the morrow: for the morrow shall
tak thought for the thing of itself. suffici unto the day is the
evil thereof.

7:1 judg not, that ye be not judged.

7:2 for with what judgment ye judge, ye shall be judged: and with what
measur ye mete, it shall be measur to you again.

7:3 and whi beholdest thou the mote that is in thi brother' eye, but
considerest not the beam that is in thine own eye?  7:4 Or how wilt
thou say to thi brother, let me pull out the mote out of thine eye;
and, behold, a beam is in thine own eye?  7:5 thou hypocrite, first
cast out the beam out of thine own eye; and then shalt thou see
clearli to cast out the mote out of thi brother' eye.

7:6 give not that which is holi unto the dogs, neither cast ye your
pearl befor swine, lest they trampl them under their feet, and turn
again and rend you.

7:7 ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock,
and it shall be open unto you: 7:8 for everi one that asketh
receiveth; and he that seeketh findeth; and to him that knocketh it
shal be opened.

7:9 Or what man is there of you, whom if hi son ask bread, will he
giv him a stone?  7:10 Or if he ask a fish, will he give him a
serpent?  7:11 If ye then, be evil, know how to give good gifts
unto your children, how much more shall your father which is in heaven
g good thing to them that ask him?  7:12 therefor all things
whatsoev ye would that men should do to you, do ye even so to them:
for thi is the law and the prophets.

7:13 enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate, and broad
i the way, that leadeth to destruction, and mani there be which go in
thereat: 7:14 becaus strait is the gate, and narrow is the way, which
leadeth unto life, and few there be that find it.

7:15 bewar of fals prophets, which come to you in sheep' clothing,
but inwardli they are raven wolves.

7:16 Ye shall know them by their fruits. Do men gather grape of
thorns, or fig of thistles?  7:17 even so everi good tree bringeth
forth good fruit; but a corrupt tree bringeth forth evil fruit.

7:18 A good tree cannot bring forth evil fruit, neither can a corrupt
tre bring forth good fruit.

7:19 everi tree that bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and
cast into the fire.

7:20 wherefor by their fruit ye shall know them.

7:21 not everi one that saith unto me, lord, lord, shall enter into
th kingdom of heaven; but he that doeth the will of my father which
i in heaven.

7:22 mani will say to me in that day, lord, lord, have we not
prophesi in thi name? and in thi name have cast out devils? and in
thi name done mani wonder works?  7:23 and then will I profess unto
them, I never knew you: depart from me, ye that work iniquity.

7:24 therefor whosoev heareth these say of mine, and doeth
them, I will liken him unto a wise man, which built hi hous upon a
rock: 7:25 and the rain descended, and the flood came, and the winds
blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell not: for it wa founded
upon a rock.

7:26 and everi one that heareth these say of mine, and doeth them
not, shall be liken unto a foolish man, which built hi hous upon
th sand: 7:27 and the rain descended, and the flood came, and the
wind blew, and beat upon that house; and it fell: and great wa the
fal of it.

7:28 and it came to pass, when jesu had end these sayings, the
peopl were astonish at hi doctrine: 7:29 for he taught them as one
hav authority, and not as the scribes.

8:1 when he wa come down from the mountain, great multitud followed
him.

8:2 and, behold, there came a leper and worship him, saying, lord,
if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

8:3 and jesu put forth hi hand, and touch him, saying, I will; be
thou clean. and immedi hi leprosi wa cleansed.

8:4 and jesu saith unto him, see thou tell no man; but go thi way,
shew thyself to the priest, and offer the gift that mose commanded,
for a testimoni unto them.

8:5 and when jesu wa enter into capernaum, there came unto him a
centurion, beseech him, 8:6 and saying, lord, my servant lieth at
hom sick of the palsy, grievous tormented.

8:7 and jesu saith unto him, I will come and heal him.

8:8 the centurion answer and said, lord, I am not worthi that thou
shouldest come under my roof: but speak the word only, and my servant
shal be healed.

8:9 for I am a man under authority, have soldier under me: and i
say to thi man, go, and he goeth; and to another, come, and he
cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

8:10 when jesu heard it, he marvelled, and said to them that
followed, verili I say unto you, I have not found so great faith, no,
not in israel.

8:11 and I say unto you, that mani shall come from the east and west,
and shall sit down with abraham, and isaac, and jacob, in the kingdom
of heaven.

8:12 but the children of the kingdom shall be cast out into outer
darkness: there shall be weep and gnash of teeth.

8:13 and jesu said unto the centurion, Go thi way; and as thou hast
believed, so be it done unto thee. and hi servant wa heal in the
selfsam hour.

8:14 and when jesu wa come into peter' house, he saw hi wife's
moth laid, and sick of a fever.

8:15 and he touch her hand, and the fever left her: and she arose,
and minist unto them.

8:16 when the even wa come, they brought unto him mani that were
possess with devils: and he cast out the spirit with hi word, and
heal all that were sick: 8:17 that it might be fulfil which was
spoken by esaia the prophet, saying, himself took our infirmities,
and bare our sicknesses.

8:18 now when jesu saw great multitud about him, he gave
command to depart unto the other side.

8:19 and a certain scribe came, and said unto him, master, I will
follow thee whithersoev thou goest.

8:20 and jesu saith unto him, the fox have holes, and the bird of
th air have nests; but the son of man hath not where to lay hi head.

8:21 and anoth of hi discipl said unto him, lord, suffer me first
to go and buri my father.

8:22 but jesu said unto him, follow me; and let the dead buri their
dead.

8:23 and when he wa enter into a ship, hi discipl follow him.

8:24 and, behold, there aros a great tempest in the sea, insomuch
that the ship wa cover with the waves: but he wa asleep.

8:25 and hi discipl came to him, and awok him, saying, lord, save
us: we perish.

8:26 and he saith unto them, whi are ye fearful, O ye of littl faith?
then he arose, and rebuk the wind and the sea; and there wa a
great calm.

8:27 but the men marvelled, saying, what manner of man is this, that
even the wind and the sea obey him!  8:28 and when he wa come to the
oth side into the countri of the gergesenes, there met him two
possess with devils, come out of the tombs, exceed fierce, so
that no man might pass by that way.

8:29 and, behold, they cri out, saying, what have we to do with
thee, jesus, thou son of god? art thou come hither to torment us
befor the time?  8:30 and there wa a good way off from them an herd
of mani swine feeding.

8:31 So the devil besought him, saying, If thou cast us out, suffer
u to go away into the herd of swine.

8:32 and he said unto them, go. and when they were come out, they went
into the herd of swine: and, behold, the whole herd of swine ran
viol down a steep place into the sea, and perish in the waters.

8:33 and they that kept them fled, and went their way into the city,
and told everi thing, and what wa befallen to the possess of the
devils.

8:34 and, behold, the whole citi came out to meet jesus: and when they
saw him, they besought him that he would depart out of their coasts.

9:1 and he enter into a ship, and pass over, and came into hi own
city.

9:2 and, behold, they brought to him a man sick of the palsy, lie on
a bed: and jesu see their faith said unto the sick of the palsy;
son, be of good cheer; thi sin be forgiven thee.

9:3 and, behold, certain of the scribe said within themselves, this
man blasphemeth.

9:4 and jesu know their thought said, wherefor think ye evil in
your hearts?  9:5 for whether is easier, to say, thi sin be forgiven
thee; or to say, arise, and walk?  9:6 but that ye may know that the
son of man hath power on earth to forgiv sins, (then saith he to the
sick of the palsy,) arise, take up thi bed, and go unto thine house.

9:7 and he arose, and depart to hi house.

9:8 but when the multitud saw it, they marvelled, and glorifi god,
which had given such power unto men.

9:9 and as jesu pass forth from thence, he saw a man, named
matthew, sit at the receipt of custom: and he saith unto him,
follow me. and he arose, and follow him.

9:10 and it came to pass, as jesu sat at meat in the house, behold,
mani publican and sinner came and sat down with him and his
disciples.

9:11 and when the pharise saw it, they said unto hi disciples, why
eateth your master with publican and sinners?  9:12 but when jesus
heard that, he said unto them, they that be whole need not a
physician, but they that are sick.

9:13 but go ye and learn what that meaneth, I will have mercy, and not
sacrifice: for I am not come to call the righteous, but sinner to
repentance.

9:14 then came to him the discipl of john, saying, whi do we and the
pharise fast oft, but thi discipl fast not?  9:15 and jesu said
unto them, can the children of the bridechamb mourn, as long as the
bridegroom is with them? but the day will come, when the bridegroom
shal be taken from them, and then shall they fast.

9:16 No man putteth a piec of new cloth unto an old garment, for that
which is put in to fill it up taketh from the garment, and the rent is
mad worse.

9:17 neither do men put new wine into old bottles: els the bottles
break, and the wine runneth out, and the bottl perish: but they put
new wine into new bottles, and both are preserved.

9:18 while he spake these thing unto them, behold, there came a
certain ruler, and worship him, saying, My daughter is even now
dead: but come and lay thi hand upon her, and she shall live.

9:19 and jesu arose, and follow him, and so did hi disciples.

9:20 and, behold, a woman, which wa diseas with an issu of blood
twelv years, came behind him, and touch the hem of hi garment:
9:21 for she said within herself, If I may but touch hi garment, i
shal be whole.

9:22 but jesu turn him about, and when he saw her, he said,
daughter, be of good comfort; thi faith hath made thee whole. and the
woman wa made whole from that hour.

9:23 and when jesu came into the ruler' house, and saw the minstrels
and the peopl make a noise, 9:24 He said unto them, give place: for
th maid is not dead, but sleepeth. and they laugh him to scorn.

9:25 but when the peopl were put forth, he went in, and took her by
th hand, and the maid arose.

9:26 and the fame hereof went abroad into all that land.

9:27 and when jesu depart thence, two blind men follow him,
crying, and saying, thou son of david, have merci on us.

9:28 and when he wa come into the house, the blind men came to him:
and jesu saith unto them, believ ye that I am abl to do this? they
said unto him, yea, lord.

9:29 then touch he their eyes, saying, accord to your faith be it
unto you.

9:30 and their eye were opened; and jesu straitli charg them,
saying, see that no man know it.

9:31 but they, when they were departed, spread abroad hi fame in all
that country.

9:32 As they went out, behold, they brought to him a dumb man
possess with a devil.

9:33 and when the devil wa cast out, the dumb spake: and the
multitud marvelled, saying, It wa never so seen in israel.

9:34 but the pharise said, He casteth out devil through the prince
of the devils.

9:35 and jesu went about all the citi and villages, teach in
their synagogues, and preach the gospel of the kingdom, and healing
everi sick and everi diseas among the people.

9:36 but when he saw the multitudes, he wa move with compass on
them, becaus they fainted, and were scatter abroad, as sheep having
no shepherd.

9:37 then saith he unto hi disciples, the harvest truli is plenteous,
but the labour are few; 9:38 pray ye therefor the lord of the
harvest, that he will send forth labour into hi harvest.

10:1 and when he had call unto him hi twelv disciples, he gave
them power against unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all
mann of sick and all manner of disease.

10:2 now the name of the twelv apostl are these; the first, simon,
who is call peter, and andrew hi brother; jame the son of zebedee,
and john hi brother; 10:3 philip, and bartholomew; thomas, and
matthew the publican; jame the son of alphaeus, and lebbaeus, whose
surnam wa thaddaeus; 10:4 simon the canaanite, and juda iscariot,
who also betray him.

10:5 these twelv jesu sent forth, and command them, saying, Go not
into the way of the gentiles, and into ani citi of the samaritans
ent ye not: 10:6 but go rather to the lost sheep of the hous of
israel.

10:7 and as ye go, preach, saying, the kingdom of heaven is at hand.

10:8 heal the sick, cleans the lepers, rais the dead, cast out
devils: freeli ye have received, freeli give.

10:9 provid neither gold, nor silver, nor brass in your purses, 10:10
nor scrip for your journey, neither two coats, neither shoes, nor yet
staves: for the workman is worthi of hi meat.

10:11 and into whatsoev citi or town ye shall enter, enquir who in
it is worthy; and there abid till ye go thence.

10:12 and when ye come into an house, salut it.

10:13 and if the hous be worthy, let your peac come upon it: but if
it be not worthy, let your peac return to you.

10:14 and whosoev shall not receiv you, nor hear your words, when
y depart out of that hous or city, shake off the dust of your feet.

10:15 verili I say unto you, It shall be more toler for the land
of sodom and gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

10:16 behold, I send you forth as sheep in the midst of wolves: be ye
therefor wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

10:17 but bewar of men: for they will deliv you up to the councils,
and they will scourg you in their synagogues; 10:18 and ye shall be
brought befor governor and king for my sake, for a testimony
against them and the gentiles.

10:19 but when they deliv you up, take no thought how or what ye
shal speak: for it shall be given you in that same hour what ye shall
speak.

10:20 for it is not ye that speak, but the spirit of your father which
speaketh in you.

10:21 and the brother shall deliv up the brother to death, and the
fath the child: and the children shall rise up against their
parents, and caus them to be put to death.

10:22 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name' sake: but he that
endureth to the end shall be saved.

10:23 but when they persecut you in thi city, flee ye into another:
for verili I say unto you, Ye shall not have gone over the citi of
israel, till the son of man be come.

10:24 the discipl is not abov hi master, nor the servant abov his
lord.

10:25 It is enough for the discipl that he be as hi master, and the
serv as hi lord. If they have call the master of the house
beelzebub, how much more shall they call them of hi household?  10:26
fear them not therefore: for there is noth covered, that shall not
b revealed; and hid, that shall not be known.

10:27 what I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in light: and what ye
hear in the ear, that preach ye upon the housetops.

10:28 and fear not them which kill the body, but are not abl to kill
th soul: but rather fear him which is abl to destroy both soul and
bodi in hell.

10:29 are not two sparrow sold for a farthing? and one of them shall
not fall on the ground without your father.

10:30 but the veri hair of your head are all numbered.

10:31 fear ye not therefore, ye are of more valu than mani sparrows.

10:32 whosoev therefor shall confess me befor men, him will i
confess also befor my father which is in heaven.

10:33 but whosoev shall deni me befor men, him will I also deny
befor my father which is in heaven.

10:34 think not that I am come to send peac on earth: I came not to
send peace, but a sword.

10:35 for I am come to set a man at varianc against hi father, and
th daughter against her mother, and the daughter in law against her
moth in law.

10:36 and a man' foe shall be they of hi own household.

10:37 He that loveth father or mother more than me is not worthi of
me: and he that loveth son or daughter more than me is not worthi of
me.

10:38 and he that taketh not hi cross, and followeth after me, is not
worthi of me.

10:39 He that findeth hi life shall lose it: and he that loseth his
lif for my sake shall find it.

10:40 He that receiveth you receiveth me, and he that receiveth me
receiveth him that sent me.

10:41 He that receiveth a prophet in the name of a prophet shall
rec a prophet' reward; and he that receiveth a righteou man in
th name of a righteou man shall receiv a righteou man' reward.

10:42 and whosoev shall give to drink unto one of these littl ones
a cup of cold water onli in the name of a disciple, verili I say unto
you, he shall in no wise lose hi reward.

11:1 and it came to pass, when jesu had made an end of command his
twelv disciples, he depart thenc to teach and to preach in their
cities.

11:2 now when john had heard in the prison the work of christ, he
sent two of hi disciples, 11:3 and said unto him, art thou he that
should come, or do we look for another?  11:4 jesu answer and said
unto them, Go and shew john again those thing which ye do hear and
see: 11:5 the blind receiv their sight, and the lame walk, the lepers
ar cleansed, and the deaf hear, the dead are rais up, and the poor
hav the gospel preach to them.

11:6 and bless is he, whosoev shall not be offend in me.

11:7 and as they departed, jesu began to say unto the multitudes
concern john, what went ye out into the wilder to see? A reed
shaken with the wind?  11:8 but what went ye out for to see? A man
cloth in soft raiment?  behold, they that wear soft cloth are in
kings' houses.

11:9 but what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you,
and more than a prophet.

11:10 for thi is he, of whom it is written, behold, I send my
messeng befor thi face, which shall prepar thi way befor thee.

11:11 verili I say unto you, among them that are born of women there
hath not risen a greater than john the baptist: notwithstand he
that is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

11:12 and from the day of john the baptist until now the kingdom of
heaven suffereth violence, and the violent take it by force.

11:13 for all the prophet and the law prophesi until john.

11:14 and if ye will receiv it, thi is elias, which wa for to come.

11:15 He that hath ear to hear, let him hear.

11:16 but whereunto shall I liken thi generation? It is like unto
children sit in the markets, and call unto their fellows, 11:17
and saying, We have pipe unto you, and ye have not danced; we have
mourn unto you, and ye have not lamented.

11:18 for john came neither eat nor drinking, and they say, He hath
a devil.

11:19 the son of man came eat and drinking, and they say, behold a
man gluttonous, and a winebibber, a friend of publican and sinners.
but wisdom is justifi of her children.

11:20 then began he to upbraid the citi wherein most of hi mighty
work were done, becaus they repent not: 11:21 woe unto thee,
chorazin! woe unto thee, bethsaida! for if the mighti works, which
wer done in you, had been done in tyre and sidon, they would have
rep long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

11:22 but I say unto you, It shall be more toler for tyre and
sidon at the day of judgment, than for you.

11:23 and thou, capernaum, which art exalt unto heaven, shalt be
brought down to hell: for if the mighti works, which have been done in
thee, had been done in sodom, it would have remain until thi day.

11:24 but I say unto you, that it shall be more toler for the land
of sodom in the day of judgment, than for thee.

11:25 At that time jesu answer and said, I thank thee, O father,
lord of heaven and earth, becaus thou hast hid these thing from the
wis and prudent, and hast reveal them unto babes.

11:26 even so, father: for so it seem good in thi sight.

11:27 all thing are deliv unto me of my father: and no man
knoweth the son, but the father; neither knoweth ani man the father,
sav the son, and he to whomsoev the son will reveal him.

11:28 come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavi laden, and I will
giv you rest.

11:29 take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly
in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.

11:30 for my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.

12:1 At that time jesu went on the sabbath day through the corn; and
hi discipl were an hungred, and began to pluck the ear of corn and
to eat.

12:2 but when the pharise saw it, they said unto him, behold, thy
discipl do that which is not law to do upon the sabbath day.

12:3 but he said unto them, have ye not read what david did, when he
wa an hungred, and they that were with him; 12:4 how he enter into
th hous of god, and did eat the shewbread, which wa not law for
him to eat, neither for them which were with him, but onli for the
priests?  12:5 Or have ye not read in the law, how that on the sabbath
day the priest in the templ profan the sabbath, and are blameless?
12:6 but I say unto you, that in thi place is one greater than the
temple.

12:7 but if ye had known what thi meaneth, I will have mercy, and not
sacrifice, ye would not have condemn the guiltless.

12:8 for the son of man is lord even of the sabbath day.

12:9 and when he wa depart thence, he went into their synagogue:
12:10 and, behold, there wa a man which had hi hand withered. and
they ask him, saying, Is it law to heal on the sabbath days? that
they might accus him.

12:11 and he said unto them, what man shall there be among you, that
shal have one sheep, and if it fall into a pit on the sabbath day,
wil he not lay hold on it, and lift it out?  12:12 how much then is a
man better than a sheep? wherefor it is law to do well on the
sabbath days.

12:13 then saith he to the man, stretch forth thine hand. and he
stretch it forth; and it wa restor whole, like as the other.

12:14 then the pharise went out, and held a council against him, how
they might destroy him.

12:15 but when jesu knew it, he withdrew himself from thence: and
great multitud follow him, and he heal them all; 12:16 and
charg them that they should not make him known: 12:17 that it might
b fulfil which wa spoken by esaia the prophet, saying, 12:18
behold my servant, whom I have chosen; my beloved, in whom my soul is
wel pleased: I will put my spirit upon him, and he shall shew
judg to the gentiles.

12:19 He shall not strive, nor cry; neither shall ani man hear his
voic in the streets.

12:20 A bruis reed shall he not break, and smoke flax shall he not
quench, till he send forth judgment unto victory.

12:21 and in hi name shall the gentil trust.

12:22 then wa brought unto him one possess with a devil, blind, and
dumb: and he heal him, insomuch that the blind and dumb both spake
and saw.

12:23 and all the peopl were amazed, and said, Is not thi the son of
david?  12:24 but when the pharise heard it, they said, thi fellow
doth not cast out devils, but by beelzebub the princ of the devils.

12:25 and jesu knew their thoughts, and said unto them, everi kingdom
divid against itself is brought to desolation; and everi citi or
hous divid against itself shall not stand: 12:26 and if satan cast
out satan, he is divid against himself; how shall then hi kingdom
stand?  12:27 and if I by beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your
children cast them out? therefor they shall be your judges.

12:28 but if I cast out devil by the spirit of god, then the kingdom
of god is come unto you.

12:29 Or els how can one enter into a strong man' house, and spoil
hi goods, except he first bind the strong man? and then he will spoil
hi house.

12:30 He that is not with me is against me; and he that gathereth not
with me scattereth abroad.

12:31 wherefor I say unto you, all manner of sin and blasphemi shall
b forgiven unto men: but the blasphemi against the holi ghost shall
not be forgiven unto men.

12:32 and whosoev speaketh a word against the son of man, it shall
b forgiven him: but whosoev speaketh against the holi ghost, it
shal not be forgiven him, neither in thi world, neither in the world
to come.

12:33 either make the tree good, and hi fruit good; or els make the
tre corrupt, and hi fruit corrupt: for the tree is known by his
fruit.

12:34 O gener of vipers, how can ye, be evil, speak good
things?  for out of the abund of the heart the mouth speaketh.

12:35 A good man out of the good treasur of the heart bringeth forth
good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasur bringeth forth
evil things.

12:36 but I say unto you, that everi idl word that men shall speak,
they shall give account thereof in the day of judgment.

12:37 for by thi word thou shalt be justified, and by thi word thou
shalt be condemned.

12:38 then certain of the scribe and of the pharise answered,
saying, master, we would see a sign from thee.

12:39 but he answer and said unto them, An evil and adulterous
gener seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be given to
it, but the sign of the prophet jonas: 12:40 for as jona wa three
day and three night in the whale' belly; so shall the son of man be
thre day and three night in the heart of the earth.

12:41 the men of nineveh shall rise in judgment with thi generation,
and shall condemn it: becaus they repent at the preach of jonas;
and, behold, a greater than jona is here.

12:42 the queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with this
generation, and shall condemn it: for she came from the uttermost
part of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon; and, behold, a
great than solomon is here.

12:43 when the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through
dri places, seek rest, and findeth none.

12:44 then he saith, I will return into my hous from whenc I came
out; and when he is come, he findeth it empty, swept, and garnished.

12:45 then goeth he, and taketh with himself seven other spirit more
wick than himself, and they enter in and dwell there: and the last
stat of that man is wors than the first. even so shall it be also
unto thi wick generation.

12:46 while he yet talk to the people, behold, hi mother and his
brethren stood without, desir to speak with him.

12:47 then one said unto him, behold, thi mother and thi brethren
stand without, desir to speak with thee.

12:48 but he answer and said unto him that told him, who is my
mother?  and who are my brethren?  12:49 and he stretch forth his
hand toward hi disciples, and said, behold my mother and my brethren!
12:50 for whosoev shall do the will of my father which is in heaven,
th same is my brother, and sister, and mother.

13:1 the same day went jesu out of the house, and sat by the sea
side.

13:2 and great multitud were gather togeth unto him, so that he
went into a ship, and sat; and the whole multitud stood on the shore.

13:3 and he spake mani thing unto them in parables, saying, behold, a
sow went forth to sow; 13:4 and when he sowed, some seed fell by
th way side, and the fowl came and devour them up: 13:5 some fell
upon stoni places, where they had not much earth: and forthwith they
sprung up, becaus they had no deep of earth: 13:6 and when the
sun wa up, they were scorched; and becaus they had no root, they
with away.

13:7 and some fell among thorns; and the thorn sprung up, and choked
them: 13:8 but other fell into good ground, and brought forth fruit,
som an hundredfold, some sixtyfold, some thirtyfold.

13:9 who hath ear to hear, let him hear.

13:10 and the discipl came, and said unto him, whi speakest thou
unto them in parables?  13:11 He answer and said unto them, because
it is given unto you to know the mysteri of the kingdom of heaven,
but to them it is not given.

13:12 for whosoev hath, to him shall be given, and he shall have
mor abundance: but whosoev hath not, from him shall be taken away
even that he hath.

13:13 therefor speak I to them in parables: becaus they see see
not; and hear they hear not, neither do they understand.

13:14 and in them is fulfil the propheci of esaias, which saith, by
hear ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and see ye shall
see, and shall not perceive: 13:15 for thi people' heart is waxed
gross, and their ear are dull of hearing, and their eye they have
closed; lest at ani time they should see with their eye and hear with
their ears, and should understand with their heart, and should be
converted, and I should heal them.

13:16 but bless are your eyes, for they see: and your ears, for they
hear.

13:17 for verili I say unto you, that mani prophet and righteou men
hav desir to see those thing which ye see, and have not seen them;
and to hear those thing which ye hear, and have not heard them.

13:18 hear ye therefor the parabl of the sower.

13:19 when ani one heareth the word of the kingdom, and understandeth
it not, then cometh the wick one, and catcheth away that which was
sown in hi heart. thi is he which receiv seed by the way side.

13:20 but he that receiv the seed into stoni places, the same is he
that heareth the word, and anon with joy receiveth it; 13:21 yet hath
h not root in himself, but dureth for a while: for when tribulation
or persecut ariseth becaus of the word, by and by he is offended.

13:22 He also that receiv seed among the thorn is he that heareth
th word; and the care of thi world, and the deceit of riches,
