chok the word, and he becometh unfruitful.

13:23 but he that receiv seed into the good ground is he that
heareth the word, and understandeth it; which also beareth fruit, and
bringeth forth, some an hundredfold, some sixty, some thirty.

13:24 anoth parabl put he forth unto them, saying, the kingdom of
heaven is liken unto a man which sow good seed in hi field: 13:25
but while men slept, hi enemi came and sow tare among the wheat,
and went hi way.

13:26 but when the blade wa sprung up, and brought forth fruit, then
appear the tare also.

13:27 So the servant of the household came and said unto him, sir,
didst not thou sow good seed in thi field? from whenc then hath it
tares?  13:28 He said unto them, An enemi hath done this. the servants
said unto him, wilt thou then that we go and gather them up?  13:29
but he said, nay; lest while ye gather up the tares, ye root up also
th wheat with them.

13:30 let both grow togeth until the harvest: and in the time of
harvest I will say to the reapers, gather ye togeth first the tares,
and bind them in bundl to burn them: but gather the wheat into my
barn.

13:31 anoth parabl put he forth unto them, saying, the kingdom of
heaven is like to a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed
in hi field: 13:32 which inde is the least of all seeds: but when
it is grown, it is the greatest among herbs, and becometh a tree, so
that the bird of the air come and lodg in the branch thereof.

13:33 anoth parabl spake he unto them; the kingdom of heaven is
lik unto leaven, which a woman took, and hid in three measur of
meal, till the whole wa leavened.

13:34 all these thing spake jesu unto the multitud in parables; and
without a parabl spake he not unto them: 13:35 that it might be
fulfil which wa spoken by the prophet, saying, I will open my
mouth in parables; I will utter thing which have been kept secret
from the foundat of the world.

13:36 then jesu sent the multitud away, and went into the house: and
hi discipl came unto him, saying, declar unto us the parabl of
th tare of the field.

13:37 He answer and said unto them, He that soweth the good seed is
th son of man; 13:38 the field is the world; the good seed are the
children of the kingdom; but the tare are the children of the wicked
one; 13:39 the enemi that sow them is the devil; the harvest is the
end of the world; and the reaper are the angels.

13:40 As therefor the tare are gather and burn in the fire; so
shal it be in the end of thi world.

13:41 the son of man shall send forth hi angels, and they shall
gath out of hi kingdom all thing that offend, and them which do
iniquity; 13:42 and shall cast them into a furnac of fire: there
shal be wail and gnash of teeth.

13:43 then shall the righteou shine forth as the sun in the kingdom
of their father. who hath ear to hear, let him hear.

13:44 again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto treasur hid in a
field; the which when a man hath found, he hideth, and for joy thereof
goeth and selleth all that he hath, and buyeth that field.

13:45 again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a merchant man,
seek goodli pearls: 13:46 who, when he had found one pearl of great
price, went and sold all that he had, and bought it.

13:47 again, the kingdom of heaven is like unto a net, that wa cast
into the sea, and gather of everi kind: 13:48 which, when it was
full, they drew to shore, and sat down, and gather the good into
vessels, but cast the bad away.

13:49 So shall it be at the end of the world: the angel shall come
forth, and sever the wick from among the just, 13:50 and shall cast
them into the furnac of fire: there shall be wail and gnash of
teeth.

13:51 jesu saith unto them, have ye understood all these things? they
say unto him, yea, lord.

13:52 then said he unto them, therefor everi scribe which is
instruct unto the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an
householder, which bringeth forth out of hi treasur thing new and
old.

13:53 and it came to pass, that when jesu had finish these
parables, he depart thence.

13:54 and when he wa come into hi own country, he taught them in
their synagogue, insomuch that they were astonished, and said, whence
hath thi man thi wisdom, and these mighti works?  13:55 Is not this
th carpenter' son? is not hi mother call mary? and hi brethren,
james, and joses, and simon, and judas?  13:56 and hi sisters, are
they not all with us? whenc then hath thi man all these things?
13:57 and they were offend in him. but jesu said unto them, a
prophet is not without honour, save in hi own country, and in hi own
house.

13:58 and he did not mani mighti work there becaus of their
unbelief.

14:1 At that time herod the tetrarch heard of the fame of jesus, 14:2
and said unto hi servants, thi is john the baptist; he is risen from
th dead; and therefor mighti work do shew forth themselv in him.

14:3 for herod had laid hold on john, and bound him, and put him in
prison for herodias' sake, hi brother philip' wife.

14:4 for john said unto him, It is not law for thee to have her.

14:5 and when he would have put him to death, he fear the multitude,
becaus they count him as a prophet.

14:6 but when herod' birthday wa kept, the daughter of herodias
danc befor them, and pleas herod.

14:7 whereupon he promis with an oath to give her whatsoev she
would ask.

14:8 and she, be befor instruct of her mother, said, give me
her john baptist' head in a charger.

14:9 and the king wa sorry: nevertheless for the oath' sake, and
them which sat with him at meat, he command it to be given her.

14:10 and he sent, and behead john in the prison.

14:11 and hi head wa brought in a charger, and given to the damsel:
and she brought it to her mother.

14:12 and hi discipl came, and took up the body, and buri it, and
went and told jesus.

14:13 when jesu heard of it, he depart thenc by ship into a desert
plac apart: and when the peopl had heard thereof, they follow him
on foot out of the cities.

14:14 and jesu went forth, and saw a great multitude, and wa moved
with compass toward them, and he heal their sick.

14:15 and when it wa evening, hi discipl came to him, saying, this
i a desert place, and the time is now past; send the multitud away,
that they may go into the villages, and buy themselv victuals.

14:16 but jesu said unto them, they need not depart; give ye them to
eat.

14:17 and they say unto him, We have here but five loaves, and two
fishes.

14:18 He said, bring them hither to me.

14:19 and he command the multitud to sit down on the grass, and
took the five loaves, and the two fishes, and look up to heaven, he
blessed, and brake, and gave the loav to hi disciples, and the
discipl to the multitude.

14:20 and they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the
frag that remain twelv basket full.

14:21 and they that had eaten were about five thousand men, beside
women and children.

14:22 and straightway jesu constrain hi discipl to get into a
ship, and to go befor him unto the other side, while he sent the
multitud away.

14:23 and when he had sent the multitud away, he went up into a
mountain apart to pray: and when the even wa come, he wa there
alone.

14:24 but the ship wa now in the midst of the sea, toss with waves:
for the wind wa contrary.

14:25 and in the fourth watch of the night jesu went unto them,
walk on the sea.

14:26 and when the discipl saw him walk on the sea, they were
troubled, saying, It is a spirit; and they cri out for fear.

14:27 but straightway jesu spake unto them, saying, Be of good cheer;
it is I; be not afraid.

14:28 and peter answer him and said, lord, if it be thou, bid me
com unto thee on the water.

14:29 and he said, come. and when peter wa come down out of the ship,
h walk on the water, to go to jesus.

14:30 but when he saw the wind boisterous, he wa afraid; and
begin to sink, he cried, saying, lord, save me.

14:31 and immedi jesu stretch forth hi hand, and caught him,
and said unto him, O thou of littl faith, wherefor didst thou doubt?
14:32 and when they were come into the ship, the wind ceased.

14:33 then they that were in the ship came and worship him, saying,
of a truth thou art the son of god.

14:34 and when they were gone over, they came into the land of
gennesaret.

14:35 and when the men of that place had knowledg of him, they sent
out into all that countri round about, and brought unto him all that
wer diseased; 14:36 and besought him that they might onli touch the
hem of hi garment: and as mani as touch were made perfectli whole.

15:1 then came to jesu scribe and pharisees, which were of
jerusalem, saying, 15:2 whi do thi discipl transgress the tradition
of the elders? for they wash not their hand when they eat bread.

15:3 but he answer and said unto them, whi do ye also transgress the
command of god by your tradition?  15:4 for god commanded, saying,
honour thi father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother,
let him die the death.

15:5 but ye say, whosoev shall say to hi father or hi mother, it
i a gift, by whatsoev thou mightest be profit by me; 15:6 and
honour not hi father or hi mother, he shall be free. thu have ye
mad the command of god of none effect by your tradition.

15:7 Ye hypocrites, well did esaia prophesi of you, saying, 15:8 this
peopl draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with
their lips; but their heart is far from me.

15:9 but in vain they do worship me, teach for doctrin the
command of men.

15:10 and he call the multitude, and said unto them, hear, and
understand: 15:11 not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man;
but that which cometh out of the mouth, thi defileth a man.

15:12 then came hi disciples, and said unto him, knowest thou that
th pharise were offended, after they heard thi saying?  15:13 but
h answer and said, everi plant, which my heavenli father hath not
planted, shall be root up.

15:14 let them alone: they be blind leader of the blind. and if the
blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.

15:15 then answer peter and said unto him, declar unto us this
parable.

15:16 and jesu said, are ye also yet without understanding?  15:17 do
not ye yet understand, that whatsoev entereth in at the mouth goeth
into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?  15:18 but those
th which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and
they defil the man.

15:19 for out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries,
fornications, thefts, fals witness, blasphemies: 15:20 these are the
th which defil a man: but to eat with unwashen hand defileth not
a man.

15:21 then jesu went thence, and depart into the coast of tyre and
sidon.

15:22 and, behold, a woman of canaan came out of the same coasts, and
cri unto him, saying, have merci on me, O lord, thou son of david;
mi daughter is grievous vex with a devil.

15:23 but he answer her not a word. and hi discipl came and
besought him, saying, send her away; for she crieth after us.

15:24 but he answer and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep
of the hous of israel.

15:25 then came she and worship him, saying, lord, help me.

15:26 but he answer and said, It is not meet to take the children's
bread, and to cast it to dogs.

15:27 and she said, truth, lord: yet the dog eat of the crumb which
fal from their masters' table.

15:28 then jesu answer and said unto her, O woman, great is thy
faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. and her daughter wa made
whol from that veri hour.

15:29 and jesu depart from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of
galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.

15:30 and great multitud came unto him, have with them those that
wer lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and mani others, and cast them down at
jesus' feet; and he heal them: 15:31 insomuch that the multitude
wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maim to be whole, the
lam to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorifi the god of
israel.

15:32 then jesu call hi discipl unto him, and said, I have
compass on the multitude, becaus they continu with me now three
days, and have noth to eat: and I will not send them away fasting,
lest they faint in the way.

15:33 and hi discipl say unto him, whenc should we have so much
bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?  15:34 and
jesu saith unto them, how mani loav have ye? and they said, seven,
and a few littl fishes.

15:35 and he command the multitud to sit down on the ground.

15:36 and he took the seven loav and the fishes, and gave thanks,
and brake them, and gave to hi disciples, and the discipl to the
multitude.

15:37 and they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the
broken meat that wa left seven basket full.

15:38 and they that did eat were four thousand men, besid women and
children.

15:39 and he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the
coast of magdala.

16:1 the pharise also with the sadduce came, and tempt desired
him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.

16:2 He answer and said unto them, when it is evening, ye say, it
wil be fair weather: for the sky is red.

16:3 and in the morning, It will be foul weather to day: for the sky
i red and lowering. O ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the
sky; but can ye not discern the sign of the times?  16:4 A wick and
adulter gener seeketh after a sign; and there shall no sign be
given unto it, but the sign of the prophet jonas. and he left them,
and departed.

16:5 and when hi discipl were come to the other side, they had
forgotten to take bread.

16:6 then jesu said unto them, take heed and bewar of the leaven of
th pharise and of the sadducees.

16:7 and they reason among themselves, saying, It is becaus we have
taken no bread.

16:8 which when jesu perceived, he said unto them, O ye of little
faith, whi reason ye among yourselves, becaus ye have brought no
bread?  16:9 Do ye not yet understand, neither rememb the five
loav of the five thousand, and how mani basket ye took up?  16:10
neither the seven loav of the four thousand, and how mani basket ye
took up?  16:11 how is it that ye do not understand that I spake it
not to you concern bread, that ye should bewar of the leaven of
th pharise and of the sadducees?  16:12 then understood they how
that he bade them not bewar of the leaven of bread, but of the
doctrin of the pharise and of the sadducees.

16:13 when jesu came into the coast of caesarea philippi, he asked
hi disciples, saying, whom do men say that I the son of man am?
16:14 and they said, some say that thou art john the baptist: some,
elias; and others, jeremias, or one of the prophets.

16:15 He saith unto them, but whom say ye that I am?  16:16 and simon
pet answer and said, thou art the christ, the son of the living
god.

16:17 and jesu answer and said unto him, bless art thou, simon
barjona: for flesh and blood hath not reveal it unto thee, but my
fath which is in heaven.

16:18 and I say also unto thee, that thou art peter, and upon this
rock I will build my church; and the gate of hell shall not prevail
against it.

16:19 and I will give unto thee the key of the kingdom of heaven: and
whatsoev thou shalt bind on earth shall be bound in heaven: and
whatsoev thou shalt loos on earth shall be loos in heaven.

16:20 then charg he hi discipl that they should tell no man that
h wa jesu the christ.

16:21 from that time forth began jesu to shew unto hi disciples, how
that he must go unto jerusalem, and suffer mani thing of the elders
and chief priest and scribes, and be killed, and be rais again the
third day.

16:22 then peter took him, and began to rebuk him, saying, Be it far
from thee, lord: thi shall not be unto thee.

16:23 but he turned, and said unto peter, get thee behind me, satan:
th art an offenc unto me: for thou savourest not the thing that be
of god, but those that be of men.

16:24 then said jesu unto hi disciples, If ani man will come after
me, let him deni himself, and take up hi cross, and follow me.

16:25 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it: and whosoever
wil lose hi life for my sake shall find it.

16:26 for what is a man profited, if he shall gain the whole world,
and lose hi own soul? or what shall a man give in exchang for his
soul?  16:27 for the son of man shall come in the glori of hi father
with hi angels; and then he shall reward everi man accord to his
works.

16:28 verili I say unto you, there be some stand here, which shall
not tast of death, till they see the son of man come in his
kingdom.

17:1 and after six day jesu taketh peter, james, and john his
brother, and bringeth them up into an high mountain apart, 17:2 and
wa transfigur befor them: and hi face did shine as the sun, and
hi raiment wa white as the light.

17:3 and, behold, there appear unto them mose and elia talking
with him.

17:4 then answer peter, and said unto jesus, lord, it is good for us
to be here: if thou wilt, let us make here three tabernacles; one for
thee, and one for moses, and one for elias.

17:5 while he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadow them: and
behold a voic out of the cloud, which said, thi is my belov son,
in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.

17:6 and when the discipl heard it, they fell on their face, and
wer sore afraid.

17:7 and jesu came and touch them, and said, arise, and be not
afraid.

17:8 and when they had lift up their eyes, they saw no man, save
jesu only.

17:9 and as they came down from the mountain, jesu charg them,
saying, tell the vision to no man, until the son of man be risen again
from the dead.

17:10 and hi discipl ask him, saying, whi then say the scribes
that elia must first come?  17:11 and jesu answer and said unto
them, elia truli shall first come, and restor all things.

17:12 but I say unto you, that elia is come already, and they knew
him not, but have done unto him whatsoev they listed. likewis shall
also the son of man suffer of them.

17:13 then the discipl understood that he spake unto them of john
th baptist.

17:14 and when they were come to the multitude, there came to him a
certain man, kneel down to him, and saying, 17:15 lord, have mercy
on my son: for he is lunatick, and sore vexed: for ofttim he falleth
into the fire, and oft into the water.

17:16 and I brought him to thi disciples, and they could not cure him.

17:17 then jesu answer and said, O faithless and perverse
generation, how long shall I be with you? how long shall I suffer you?
br him hither to me.

17:18 and jesu rebuk the devil; and he depart out of him: and the
child wa cure from that veri hour.

17:19 then came the discipl to jesu apart, and said, whi could not
w cast him out?  17:20 and jesu said unto them, becaus of your
unbelief: for verili I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of
mustard seed, ye shall say unto thi mountain, remov henc to yonder
place; and it shall remove; and noth shall be imposs unto you.

17:21 howbeit thi kind goeth not out but by prayer and fasting.

17:22 and while they abod in galilee, jesu said unto them, the son
of man shall be betray into the hand of men: 17:23 and they shall
kil him, and the third day he shall be rais again.

and they were exceed sorry.

17:24 and when they were come to capernaum, they that receiv tribute
money came to peter, and said, doth not your master pay tribute?
17:25 He saith, yes. and when he wa come into the house, jesus
prev him, saying, what thinkest thou, simon? of whom do the kings
of the earth take custom or tribute? of their own children, or of
strangers?  17:26 peter saith unto him, Of strangers. jesu saith unto
him, then are the children free.

17:27 notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea,
and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when
thou hast open hi mouth, thou shalt find a piec of money: that
take, and give unto them for me and thee.

18:1 At the same time came the discipl unto jesus, saying, who is
th greatest in the kingdom of heaven?  18:2 and jesu call a little
child unto him, and set him in the midst of them, 18:3 and said,
verili I say unto you, except ye be converted, and becom as little
children, ye shall not enter into the kingdom of heaven.

18:4 whosoev therefor shall humbl himself as thi littl child,
th same is greatest in the kingdom of heaven.

18:5 and whoso shall receiv one such littl child in my name
receiveth me.

18:6 but whoso shall offend one of these littl one which believ in
me, it were better for him that a millston were hang about his
neck, and that he were drown in the depth of the sea.

18:7 woe unto the world becaus of offences! for it must need be that
off come; but woe to that man by whom the offenc cometh!  18:8
wherefor if thi hand or thi foot offend thee, cut them off, and cast
them from thee: it is better for thee to enter into life halt or
maimed, rather than have two hand or two feet to be cast into
everlast fire.

18:9 and if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out, and cast it from
thee: it is better for thee to enter into life with one eye, rather
than have two eye to be cast into hell fire.

18:10 take heed that ye despis not one of these littl ones; for i
say unto you, that in heaven their angel do alway behold the face of
mi father which is in heaven.

18:11 for the son of man is come to save that which wa lost.

18:12 how think ye? if a man have an hundr sheep, and one of them be
gon astray, doth he not leav the nineti and nine, and goeth into the
mountains, and seeketh that which is gone astray?  18:13 and if so be
that he find it, verili I say unto you, he rejoiceth more of that
sheep, than of the nineti and nine which went not astray.

18:14 even so it is not the will of your father which is in heaven,
that one of these littl one should perish.

18:15 moreov if thi brother shall trespass against thee, go and tell
him hi fault between thee and him alone: if he shall hear thee, thou
hast gain thi brother.

18:16 but if he will not hear thee, then take with thee one or two
more, that in the mouth of two or three wit everi word may be
established.

18:17 and if he shall neglect to hear them, tell it unto the church:
but if he neglect to hear the church, let him be unto thee as an
heathen man and a publican.

18:18 verili I say unto you, whatsoev ye shall bind on earth shall
b bound in heaven: and whatsoev ye shall loos on earth shall be
loos in heaven.

18:19 again I say unto you, that if two of you shall agre on earth as
touch ani thing that they shall ask, it shall be done for them of
mi father which is in heaven.

18:20 for where two or three are gather togeth in my name, there
am I in the midst of them.

18:21 then came peter to him, and said, lord, how oft shall my brother
sin against me, and I forgiv him? till seven times?  18:22 jesus
saith unto him, I say not unto thee, until seven times: but, until
seventi time seven.

18:23 therefor is the kingdom of heaven liken unto a certain king,
which would take account of hi servants.

18:24 and when he had begun to reckon, one wa brought unto him, which
ow him ten thousand talents.

18:25 but forasmuch as he had not to pay, hi lord command him to be
sold, and hi wife, and children, and all that he had, and payment to
b made.

18:26 the servant therefor fell down, and worship him, saying,
lord, have patienc with me, and I will pay thee all.

18:27 then the lord of that servant wa move with compassion, and
loos him, and forgav him the debt.

18:28 but the same servant went out, and found one of his
fellowservants, which owe him an hundr pence: and he laid hand on
him, and took him by the throat, saying, pay me that thou owest.

18:29 and hi fellowserv fell down at hi feet, and besought him,
saying, have patienc with me, and I will pay thee all.

18:30 and he would not: but went and cast him into prison, till he
should pay the debt.

18:31 So when hi fellowserv saw what wa done, they were very
sorry, and came and told unto their lord all that wa done.

18:32 then hi lord, after that he had call him, said unto him, o
thou wick servant, I forgav thee all that debt, becaus thou
desiredst me: 18:33 shouldest not thou also have had compass on thy
fellowservant, even as I had piti on thee?  18:34 and hi lord was
wroth, and deliv him to the tormentors, till he should pay all
that wa due unto him.

18:35 So likewis shall my heavenli father do also unto you, if ye
from your heart forgiv not everi one hi brother their trespasses.

19:1 and it came to pass, that when jesu had finish these sayings,
h depart from galilee, and came into the coast of judaea beyond
jordan; 19:2 and great multitud follow him; and he heal them
there.

19:3 the pharise also came unto him, tempt him, and say unto
him, Is it law for a man to put away hi wife for everi cause?
19:4 and he answer and said unto them, have ye not read, that he
which made them at the begin made them male and female, 19:5 and
said, for thi caus shall a man leav father and mother, and shall
cleav to hi wife: and they twain shall be one flesh?  19:6 wherefore
they are no more twain, but one flesh. what therefor god hath joined
together, let not man put asunder.

19:7 they say unto him, whi did mose then command to give a writing
of divorcement, and to put her away?  19:8 He saith unto them, moses
becaus of the hard of your heart suffer you to put away your
wives: but from the begin it wa not so.

19:9 and I say unto you, whosoev shall put away hi wife, except it
b for fornication, and shall marri another, committeth adultery: and
whoso marrieth her which is put away doth commit adultery.

19:10 hi discipl say unto him, If the case of the man be so with
hi wife, it is not good to marry.

19:11 but he said unto them, all men cannot receiv thi saying, save
they to whom it is given.

19:12 for there are some eunuchs, which were so born from their
mother' womb: and there are some eunuchs, which were made eunuch of
men: and there be eunuchs, which have made themselv eunuch for the
kingdom of heaven' sake. He that is abl to receiv it, let him
rec it.

19:13 then were there brought unto him littl children, that he should
put hi hand on them, and pray: and the discipl rebuk them.

19:14 but jesu said, suffer littl children, and forbid them not, to
com unto me: for of such is the kingdom of heaven.

19:15 and he laid hi hand on them, and depart thence.

19:16 and, behold, one came and said unto him, good master, what good
th shall I do, that I may have etern life?  19:17 and he said
unto him, whi callest thou me good? there is none good but one, that
is, god: but if thou wilt enter into life, keep the commandments.

19:18 He saith unto him, which? jesu said, thou shalt do no murder,
th shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not
bear fals witness, 19:19 honour thi father and thi mother: and, thou
shalt love thi neighbour as thyself.

19:20 the young man saith unto him, all these thing have I kept from
mi youth up: what lack I yet?  19:21 jesu said unto him, If thou wilt
b perfect, go and sell that thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou
shalt have treasur in heaven: and come and follow me.

19:22 but when the young man heard that saying, he went away
sorrowful: for he had great possessions.

19:23 then said jesu unto hi disciples, verili I say unto you, that
a rich man shall hardli enter into the kingdom of heaven.

19:24 and again I say unto you, It is easier for a camel to go through
th eye of a needle, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of
god.

19:25 when hi discipl heard it, they were exceedingli amazed,
saying, who then can be saved?  19:26 but jesu beheld them, and said
unto them, with men thi is impossible; but with god all thing are
possible.

19:27 then answer peter and said unto him, behold, we have forsaken
all, and follow thee; what shall we have therefore?  19:28 and jesus
said unto them, verili I say unto you, that ye which have follow me,
in the regener when the son of man shall sit in the throne of his
glory, ye also shall sit upon twelv thrones, judg the twelve
trib of israel.

19:29 and everi one that hath forsaken houses, or brethren, or
sisters, or father, or mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my
name' sake, shall receiv an hundredfold, and shall inherit
everlast life.

19:30 but mani that are first shall be last; and the last shall be
first.

20:1 for the kingdom of heaven is like unto a man that is an
householder, which went out earli in the morn to hire labourers
into hi vineyard.

20:2 and when he had agre with the labour for a penni a day, he
sent them into hi vineyard.

20:3 and he went out about the third hour, and saw other standing
idl in the marketplace, 20:4 and said unto them; Go ye also into the
vineyard, and whatsoev is right I will give you. and they went their
way.

20:5 again he went out about the sixth and ninth hour, and did
likewise.

20:6 and about the eleventh hour he went out, and found others
stand idle, and saith unto them, whi stand ye here all the day
idle?  20:7 they say unto him, becaus no man hath hire us. He saith
unto them, Go ye also into the vineyard; and whatsoev is right, that
shal ye receive.

20:8 So when even wa come, the lord of the vineyard saith unto his
steward, call the labourers, and give them their hire, begin from
th last unto the first.

20:9 and when they came that were hire about the eleventh hour, they
receiv everi man a penny.

20:10 but when the first came, they suppos that they should have
receiv more; and they likewis receiv everi man a penny.

20:11 and when they had receiv it, they murmur against the goodman
of the house, 20:12 saying, these last have wrought but one hour, and
thou hast made them equal unto us, which have born the burden and
heat of the day.

20:13 but he answer one of them, and said, friend, I do thee no
wrong: didst not thou agre with me for a penny?  20:14 take that
thin is, and go thi way: I will give unto thi last, even as unto
thee.

20:15 Is it not law for me to do what I will with mine own? is
thin eye evil, becaus I am good?  20:16 So the last shall be first,
and the first last: for mani be called, but few chosen.

20:17 and jesu go up to jerusalem took the twelv discipl apart
in the way, and said unto them, 20:18 behold, we go up to jerusalem;
and the son of man shall be betray unto the chief priest and unto
th scribes, and they shall condemn him to death, 20:19 and shall
deliv him to the gentil to mock, and to scourge, and to crucify
him: and the third day he shall rise again.

20:20 then came to him the mother of zebede children with her sons,
worship him, and desir a certain thing of him.

20:21 and he said unto her, what wilt thou? she saith unto him, grant
that these my two son may sit, the one on thi right hand, and the
oth on the left, in thi kingdom.

20:22 but jesu answer and said, Ye know not what ye ask. are ye
abl to drink of the cup that I shall drink of, and to be baptized
with the baptism that I am baptiz with? they say unto him, We are
able.

20:23 and he saith unto them, Ye shall drink inde of my cup, and be
bapt with the baptism that I am baptiz with: but to sit on my
right hand, and on my left, is not mine to give, but it shall be given
to them for whom it is prepar of my father.

20:24 and when the ten heard it, they were move with indignation
against the two brethren.

20:25 but jesu call them unto him, and said, Ye know that the
princ of the gentil exercis dominion over them, and they that are
great exercis author upon them.

20:26 but it shall not be so among you: but whosoev will be great
among you, let him be your minister; 20:27 and whosoev will be chief
among you, let him be your servant: 20:28 even as the son of man came
not to be minist unto, but to minister, and to give hi life a
ransom for many.

20:29 and as they depart from jericho, a great multitud followed
him.

20:30 and, behold, two blind men sit by the way side, when they
heard that jesu pass by, cri out, saying, have merci on us, o
lord, thou son of david.

20:31 and the multitud rebuk them, becaus they should hold their
peace: but they cri the more, saying, have merci on us, O lord, thou
son of david.

20:32 and jesu stood still, and call them, and said, what will ye
that I shall do unto you?  20:33 they say unto him, lord, that our
ey may be opened.

20:34 So jesu had compass on them, and touch their eyes: and
immedi their eye receiv sight, and they follow him.

21:1 and when they drew nigh unto jerusalem, and were come to
bethphage, unto the mount of olives, then sent jesu two disciples,
21:2 say unto them, Go into the villag over against you, and
straightway ye shall find an ass tied, and a colt with her: loose
them, and bring them unto me.

21:3 and if ani man say ought unto you, ye shall say, the lord hath
ne of them; and straightway he will send them.

21:4 all thi wa done, that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by
th prophet, saying, 21:5 tell ye the daughter of sion, behold, thy
k cometh unto thee, meek, and sit upon an ass, and a colt the
foal of an ass.

21:6 and the discipl went, and did as jesu command them, 21:7 and
brought the ass, and the colt, and put on them their clothes, and they
set him thereon.

21:8 and a veri great multitud spread their garment in the way;
oth cut down branch from the trees, and straw them in the way.

21:9 and the multitud that went before, and that followed, cried,
saying, hosanna to the son of david: bless is he that cometh in the
nam of the lord; hosanna in the highest.

21:10 and when he wa come into jerusalem, all the citi wa moved,
saying, who is this?  21:11 and the multitud said, thi is jesu the
prophet of nazareth of galilee.

21:12 and jesu went into the templ of god, and cast out all them
that sold and bought in the temple, and overthrew the tabl of the
moneychangers, and the seat of them that sold doves, 21:13 and said
unto them, It is written, My hous shall be call the hous of
prayer; but ye have made it a den of thieves.

21:14 and the blind and the lame came to him in the temple; and he
heal them.

21:15 and when the chief priest and scribe saw the wonder things
that he did, and the children cri in the temple, and saying,
hosanna to the son of david; they were sore displeased, 21:16 and said
unto him, hearest thou what these say? and jesu saith unto them, yea;
hav ye never read, out of the mouth of babe and suckl thou hast
perfect praise?  21:17 and he left them, and went out of the city
into bethany; and he lodg there.

21:18 now in the morn as he return into the city, he hungered.

21:19 and when he saw a fig tree in the way, he came to it, and found
noth thereon, but leav only, and said unto it, let no fruit grow
on thee henceforward for ever. and present the fig tree withered
away.

21:20 and when the discipl saw it, they marvelled, saying, how soon
i the fig tree wither away!  21:21 jesu answer and said unto
them, verili I say unto you, If ye have faith, and doubt not, ye shall
not onli do thi which is done to the fig tree, but also if ye shall
say unto thi mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the
sea; it shall be done.

21:22 and all things, whatsoev ye shall ask in prayer, believing, ye
shal receive.

21:23 and when he wa come into the temple, the chief priest and the
eld of the peopl came unto him as he wa teaching, and said, by
what author doest thou these things? and who gave thee this
authority?  21:24 and jesu answer and said unto them, I also will
ask you one thing, which if ye tell me, I in like wise will tell you
bi what author I do these things.

21:25 the baptism of john, whenc wa it? from heaven, or of men? and
they reason with themselves, saying, If we shall say, from heaven;
h will say unto us, whi did ye not then believ him?  21:26 but if we
shal say, Of men; we fear the people; for all hold john as a prophet.

21:27 and they answer jesus, and said, We cannot tell. and he said
unto them, neither tell I you by what author I do these things.

21:28 but what think ye? A certain man had two sons; and he came to
th first, and said, son, go work to day in my vineyard.

21:29 He answer and said, I will not: but afterward he repented, and
went.

21:30 and he came to the second, and said likewise. and he answered
and said, I go, sir: and went not.

21:31 whether of them twain did the will of hi father? they say unto
him, the first. jesu saith unto them, verili I say unto you, that the
publican and the harlot go into the kingdom of god befor you.

21:32 for john came unto you in the way of righteousness, and ye
believ him not: but the publican and the harlot believ him: and
ye, when ye had seen it, repent not afterward, that ye might believe
him.

21:33 hear anoth parable: there wa a certain householder, which
plant a vineyard, and hedg it round about, and dig a winepress
in it, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into
a far country: 21:34 and when the time of the fruit drew near, he sent
hi servant to the husbandmen, that they might receiv the fruit of
it.

21:35 and the husbandmen took hi servants, and beat one, and killed
another, and stone another.

21:36 again, he sent other servant more than the first: and they did
unto them likewise.

21:37 but last of all he sent unto them hi son, saying, they will
rever my son.

21:38 but when the husbandmen saw the son, they said among themselves,
thi is the heir; come, let us kill him, and let us seiz on his
inheritance.

21:39 and they caught him, and cast him out of the vineyard, and slew
him.

21:40 when the lord therefor of the vineyard cometh, what will he do
unto those husbandmen?  21:41 they say unto him, He will miserably
destroy those wick men, and will let out hi vineyard unto other
husbandmen, which shall render him the fruit in their seasons.

21:42 jesu saith unto them, did ye never read in the scriptures, the
ston which the builder rejected, the same is becom the head of the
corner: thi is the lord' doing, and it is marvel in our eyes?
21:43 therefor say I unto you, the kingdom of god shall be taken from
you, and given to a nation bring forth the fruit thereof.

21:44 and whosoev shall fall on thi stone shall be broken: but on
whomsoev it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

21:45 and when the chief priest and pharise had heard hi parables,
they perceiv that he spake of them.

21:46 but when they sought to lay hand on him, they fear the
multitude, becaus they took him for a prophet.

22:1 and jesu answer and spake unto them again by parables, and
said, 22:2 the kingdom of heaven is like unto a certain king, which
mad a marriag for hi son, 22:3 and sent forth hi servant to call
them that were bidden to the wedding: and they would not come.

22:4 again, he sent forth other servants, saying, tell them which are
bidden, behold, I have prepar my dinner: my oxen and my fatl are
killed, and all thing are ready: come unto the marriage.

22:5 but they made light of it, and went their ways, one to hi farm,
anoth to hi merchandise: 22:6 and the remnant took hi servants,
and entreat them spitefully, and slew them.

22:7 but when the king heard thereof, he wa wroth: and he sent forth
hi armies, and destroy those murderers, and burn up their city.

22:8 then saith he to hi servants, the wed is ready, but they
which were bidden were not worthy.

22:9 Go ye therefor into the highways, and as mani as ye shall find,
bid to the marriage.

22:10 So those servant went out into the highways, and gathered
togeth all as mani as they found, both bad and good: and the wedding
wa furnish with guests.

22:11 and when the king came in to see the guests, he saw there a man
which had not on a wed garment: 22:12 and he saith unto him,
friend, how camest thou in hither not have a wed garment? and he
wa speechless.

22:13 then said the king to the servants, bind him hand and foot, and
tak him away, and cast him into outer darkness, there shall be
weep and gnash of teeth.

22:14 for mani are called, but few are chosen.

22:15 then went the pharisees, and took counsel how they might
entangl him in hi talk.

22:16 and they sent out unto him their discipl with the herodians,
saying, master, we know that thou art true, and teachest the way of
god in truth, neither carest thou for ani man: for thou regardest not
th person of men.

22:17 tell us therefore, what thinkest thou? Is it law to give
tribut unto caesar, or not?  22:18 but jesu perceiv their
wickedness, and said, whi tempt ye me, ye hypocrites?  22:19 shew me
th tribut money. and they brought unto him a penny.

22:20 and he saith unto them, whose is thi imag and superscription?
22:21 they say unto him, caesar's. then saith he unto them, render
therefor unto caesar the thing which are caesar's; and unto god the
th that are god's.

22:22 when they had heard these words, they marvelled, and left him,
and went their way.

22:23 the same day came to him the sadducees, which say that there is
no resurrection, and ask him, 22:24 saying, master, mose said, If a
man die, have no children, hi brother shall marri hi wife, and
rais up seed unto hi brother.

22:25 now there were with us seven brethren: and the first, when he
had marri a wife, deceased, and, have no issue, left hi wife unto
hi brother: 22:26 likewis the second also, and the third, unto the
seventh.

22:27 and last of all the woman die also.

22:28 therefor in the resurrect whose wife shall she be of the
seven?  for they all had her.

22:29 jesu answer and said unto them, Ye do err, not know the
scriptures, nor the power of god.

22:30 for in the resurrect they neither marry, nor are given in
marriage, but are as the angel of god in heaven.

22:31 but as touch the resurrect of the dead, have ye not read
that which wa spoken unto you by god, saying, 22:32 I am the god of
abraham, and the god of isaac, and the god of jacob?  god is not the
god of the dead, but of the living.

22:33 and when the multitud heard this, they were astonish at his
doctrine.

22:34 but when the pharise had heard that he had put the sadducees
to silence, they were gather together.

22:35 then one of them, which wa a lawyer, ask him a question,
tempt him, and saying, 22:36 master, which is the great commandment
in the law?  22:37 jesu said unto him, thou shalt love the lord thy
god with all thi heart, and with all thi soul, and with all thi mind.

22:38 thi is the first and great commandment.

22:39 and the second is like unto it, thou shalt love thi neighbour as
thyself.

22:40 On these two command hang all the law and the prophets.

22:41 while the pharise were gather together, jesu ask them,
22:42 saying, what think ye of christ? whose son is he? they say unto
him, the son of david.

22:43 He saith unto them, how then doth david in spirit call him lord,
saying, 22:44 the lord said unto my lord, sit thou on my right hand,
til I make thine enemi thi footstool?  22:45 If david then call him
lord, how is he hi son?  22:46 and no man wa abl to answer him a
word, neither durst ani man from that day forth ask him ani more
questions.

23:1 then spake jesu to the multitude, and to hi disciples, 23:2
say the scribe and the pharise sit in moses' seat: 23:3 all
therefor whatsoev they bid you observe, that observ and do; but do
not ye after their works: for they say, and do not.

23:4 for they bind heavi burden and grievou to be borne, and lay
them on men' shoulders; but they themselv will not move them with
on of their fingers.

23:5 but all their work they do for to be seen of men: they make
broad their phylacteries, and enlarg the border of their garments,
23:6 and love the uppermost room at feasts, and the chief seat in
th synagogues, 23:7 and greet in the markets, and to be call of
men, rabbi, rabbi.

23:8 but be not ye call rabbi: for one is your master, even christ;
and all ye are brethren.

23:9 and call no man your father upon the earth: for one is your
father, which is in heaven.

23:10 neither be ye call masters: for one is your master, even
christ.

23:11 but he that is greatest among you shall be your servant.

23:12 and whosoev shall exalt himself shall be abased; and he that
shal humbl himself shall be exalted.

23:13 but woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye shut
up the kingdom of heaven against men: for ye neither go in yourselves,
neith suffer ye them that are enter to go in.

23:14 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye devour
widows' houses, and for a pretenc make long prayer: therefor ye
shal receiv the greater damnation.

23:15 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye compass
sea and land to make one proselyte, and when he is made, ye make him
twofold more the child of hell than yourselves.

23:16 woe unto you, ye blind guides, which say, whosoev shall swear
bi the temple, it is nothing; but whosoev shall swear by the gold of
th temple, he is a debtor!  23:17 Ye fool and blind: for whether is
greater, the gold, or the templ that sanctifieth the gold?  23:18
and, whosoev shall swear by the altar, it is nothing; but whosoever
sweareth by the gift that is upon it, he is guilty.

23:19 Ye fool and blind: for whether is greater, the gift, or the
altar that sanctifieth the gift?  23:20 whoso therefor shall swear by
th altar, sweareth by it, and by all thing thereon.

23:21 and whoso shall swear by the temple, sweareth by it, and by him
that dwelleth therein.

23:22 and he that shall swear by heaven, sweareth by the throne of
god, and by him that sitteth thereon.

23:23 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye pay
tith of mint and anis and cummin, and have omit the weightier
matt of the law, judgment, mercy, and faith: these ought ye to have
done, and not to leav the other undone.

23:24 Ye blind guides, which strain at a gnat, and swallow a camel.

23:25 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make
clean the outsid of the cup and of the platter, but within they are
ful of extort and excess.

23:26 thou blind pharisee, cleans first that which is within the cup
and platter, that the outsid of them may be clean also.

23:27 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like
unto white sepulchres, which inde appear beauti outward, but are
within full of dead men' bones, and of all uncleanness.

23:28 even so ye also outwardli appear righteou unto men, but within
y are full of hypocrisi and iniquity.

23:29 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! becaus ye
build the tomb of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchr of the
righteous, 23:30 and say, If we had been in the day of our fathers,
w would not have been partak with them in the blood of the
prophets.

23:31 wherefor ye be wit unto yourselves, that ye are the
children of them which kill the prophets.

23:32 fill ye up then the measur of your fathers.

23:33 Ye serpents, ye gener of vipers, how can ye escap the
damn of hell?  23:34 wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets,
and wise men, and scribes: and some of them ye shall kill and crucify;
and some of them shall ye scourg in your synagogues, and persecute
them from citi to city: 23:35 that upon you may come all the righteous
blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteou abel unto the
blood of zacharia son of barachias, whom ye slew between the temple
and the altar.

23:36 verili I say unto you, all these thing shall come upon this
generation.

23:37 O jerusalem, jerusalem, thou that killest the prophets, and
stonest them which are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered
thi children together, even as a hen gathereth her chicken under her
wings, and ye would not!  23:38 behold, your hous is left unto you
desolate.

23:39 for I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye
shal say, bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord.

24:1 and jesu went out, and depart from the temple: and his
discipl came to him for to shew him the build of the temple.

24:2 and jesu said unto them, see ye not all these things? verili i
say unto you, there shall not be left here one stone upon another,
that shall not be thrown down.

24:3 and as he sat upon the mount of olives, the discipl came unto
him privately, saying, tell us, when shall these thing be? and what
shal be the sign of thi coming, and of the end of the world?  24:4
and jesu answer and said unto them, take heed that no man deceive
you.

24:5 for mani shall come in my name, saying, I am christ; and shall
dec many.

24:6 and ye shall hear of war and rumour of wars: see that ye be not
troubled: for all these thing must come to pass, but the end is not
yet.

24:7 for nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against
kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes,
in diver places.

24:8 all these are the begin of sorrows.

24:9 then shall they deliv you up to be afflicted, and shall kill
you: and ye shall be hate of all nation for my name' sake.

24:10 and then shall mani be offended, and shall betray one another,
and shall hate one another.

24:11 and mani fals prophet shall rise, and shall deceiv many.

24:12 and becaus iniqu shall abound, the love of mani shall wax
cold.

24:13 but he that shall endur unto the end, the same shall be saved.

24:14 and thi gospel of the kingdom shall be preach in all the
world for a wit unto all nations; and then shall the end come.

24:15 when ye therefor shall see the abomin of desolation,
spoken of by daniel the prophet, stand in the holi place, (whoso
readeth, let him understand:) 24:16 then let them which be in judaea
fle into the mountains: 24:17 let him which is on the housetop not
com down to take ani thing out of hi house: 24:18 neither let him
which is in the field return back to take hi clothes.

24:19 and woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give
suck in those days!  24:20 but pray ye that your flight be not in the
winter, neither on the sabbath day: 24:21 for then shall be great
tribulation, such as wa not sinc the begin of the world to this
time, no, nor ever shall be.

24:22 and except those day should be shortened, there should no flesh
b saved: but for the elect' sake those day shall be shortened.

24:23 then if ani man shall say unto you, lo, here is christ, or
there; believ it not.

24:24 for there shall aris fals christs, and fals prophets, and
shal shew great sign and wonders; insomuch that, if it were
possible, they shall deceiv the veri elect.

24:25 behold, I have told you before.

24:26 wherefor if they shall say unto you, behold, he is in the
desert; go not forth: behold, he is in the secret chambers; believ it
not.

24:27 for as the lightn cometh out of the east, and shineth even
unto the west; so shall also the come of the son of man be.

24:28 for wheresoev the carcas is, there will the eagl be
gath together.

24:29 immedi after the tribul of those day shall the sun be
darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the star shall
fal from heaven, and the power of the heaven shall be shaken: 24:30
and then shall appear the sign of the son of man in heaven: and then
shal all the tribe of the earth mourn, and they shall see the son of
man come in the cloud of heaven with power and great glory.

24:31 and he shall send hi angel with a great sound of a trumpet,
and they shall gather togeth hi elect from the four winds, from one
end of heaven to the other.

24:32 now learn a parabl of the fig tree; when hi branch is yet
tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is nigh: 24:33
so likewis ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is
near, even at the doors.

24:34 verili I say unto you, thi gener shall not pass, till all
thes thing be fulfilled.

24:35 heaven and earth shall pass away, but my word shall not pass
away.

24:36 but of that day and hour knoweth no man, no, not the angel of
heaven, but my father only.

24:37 but as the day of noe were, so shall also the come of the son
of man be.

24:38 for as in the day that were befor the flood they were eating
and drinking, marri and give in marriage, until the day that noe
ent into the ark, 24:39 and knew not until the flood came, and
took them all away; so shall also the come of the son of man be.

24:40 then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the
oth left.

24:41 two women shall be grind at the mill; the one shall be taken,
and the other left.

24:42 watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your lord doth come.

24:43 but know this, that if the goodman of the hous had known in
what watch the thief would come, he would have watched, and would not
hav suffer hi hous to be broken up.

24:44 therefor be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not
th son of man cometh.

24:45 who then is a faith and wise servant, whom hi lord hath made
rul over hi household, to give them meat in due season?  24:46
bless is that servant, whom hi lord when he cometh shall find so
doing.

24:47 verili I say unto you, that he shall make him ruler over all his
goods.

24:48 but and if that evil servant shall say in hi heart, My lord
delayeth hi coming; 24:49 and shall begin to smite his
fellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken; 24:50 the lord
of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and
in an hour that he is not awar of, 24:51 and shall cut him asunder,
and appoint him hi portion with the hypocrites: there shall be
weep and gnash of teeth.

25:1 then shall the kingdom of heaven be liken unto ten virgins,
which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

25:2 and five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

25:3 they that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with
them: 25:4 but the wise took oil in their vessel with their lamps.

25:5 while the bridegroom tarried, they all slumber and slept.

25:6 and at midnight there wa a cri made, behold, the bridegroom
cometh; go ye out to meet him.

25:7 then all those virgin arose, and trim their lamps.

25:8 and the foolish said unto the wise, give us of your oil; for our
lamp are gone out.

25:9 but the wise answered, saying, not so; lest there be not enough
for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for
yourselves.

25:10 and while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that
wer readi went in with him to the marriage: and the door wa shut.

25:11 afterward came also the other virgins, saying, lord, lord, open
to us.

25:12 but he answer and said, verili I say unto you, I know you not.

25:13 watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour
wherein the son of man cometh.

25:14 for the kingdom of heaven is as a man travel into a far
country, who call hi own servants, and deliv unto them his
goods.

25:15 and unto one he gave five talents, to anoth two, and to
anoth one; to everi man accord to hi sever ability; and
straightway took hi journey.

25:16 then he that had receiv the five talent went and trade with
th same, and made them other five talents.

25:17 and likewis he that had receiv two, he also gain other two.

25:18 but he that had receiv one went and dig in the earth, and
hid hi lord' money.

25:19 after a long time the lord of those servant cometh, and
reckoneth with them.

25:20 and so he that had receiv five talent came and brought other
f talents, saying, lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents:
behold, I have gain besid them five talent more.

25:21 hi lord said unto him, well done, thou good and faithful
servant: thou hast been faith over a few things, I will make thee
rul over mani things: enter thou into the joy of thi lord.

25:22 He also that had receiv two talent came and said, lord, thou
deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gain two other
tal besid them.

25:23 hi lord said unto him, well done, good and faith servant;
th hast been faith over a few things, I will make thee ruler over
mani things: enter thou into the joy of thi lord.

25:24 then he which had receiv the one talent came and said, lord, i
knew thee that thou art an hard man, reap where thou hast not sown,
and gather where thou hast not strawed: 25:25 and I wa afraid, and
went and hid thi talent in the earth: lo, there thou hast that is
thine.

25:26 hi lord answer and said unto him, thou wick and slothful
servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sow not, and gather where
i have not strawed: 25:27 thou oughtest therefor to have put my money
to the exchangers, and then at my come I should have receiv mine
own with usury.

25:28 take therefor the talent from him, and give it unto him which
hath ten talents.

25:29 for unto everi one that hath shall be given, and he shall have
abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that
which he hath.

25:30 and cast ye the unprofit servant into outer darkness: there
shal be weep and gnash of teeth.

25:31 when the son of man shall come in hi glory, and all the holy
angel with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of hi glory: 25:32
and befor him shall be gather all nations: and he shall separate
them one from another, as a shepherd divideth hi sheep from the
goats: 25:33 and he shall set the sheep on hi right hand, but the
goat on the left.

25:34 then shall the king say unto them on hi right hand, come, ye
bless of my father, inherit the kingdom prepar for you from the
found of the world: 25:35 for I wa an hungred, and ye gave me
meat: I wa thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I wa a stranger, and ye
took me in: 25:36 naked, and ye cloth me: I wa sick, and ye visited
me: I wa in prison, and ye came unto me.

25:37 then shall the righteou answer him, saying, lord, when saw we
the an hungred, and fed thee? or thirsty, and gave thee drink?  25:38
when saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed
thee?  25:39 Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto
thee?  25:40 and the king shall answer and say unto them, verili I say
unto you, inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these
mi brethren, ye have done it unto me.

25:41 then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, depart from
me, ye cursed, into everlast fire, prepar for the devil and his
angels: 25:42 for I wa an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was
thirsty, and ye gave me no drink: 25:43 I wa a stranger, and ye took
m not in: naked, and ye cloth me not: sick, and in prison, and ye
visit me not.

25:44 then shall they also answer him, saying, lord, when saw we thee
an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in
prison, and did not minist unto thee?  25:45 then shall he answer
them, saying, verili I say unto you, inasmuch as ye did it not to one
of the least of these, ye did it not to me.

25:46 and these shall go away into everlast punishment: but the
right into life eternal.

26:1 and it came to pass, when jesu had finish all these sayings,
h said unto hi disciples, 26:2 Ye know that after two day is the
feast of the passover, and the son of man is betray to be crucified.

26:3 then assembl togeth the chief priests, and the scribes, and
th elder of the people, unto the palac of the high priest, who was
cal caiaphas, 26:4 and consult that they might take jesu by
subtilty, and kill him.

26:5 but they said, not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar
among the people.

26:6 now when jesu wa in bethany, in the hous of simon the leper,
26:7 there came unto him a woman have an alabast box of very
preci ointment, and pour it on hi head, as he sat at meat.

26:8 but when hi discipl saw it, they had indignation, saying, to
what purpos is thi waste?  26:9 for thi ointment might have been
sold for much, and given to the poor.

26:10 when jesu understood it, he said unto them, whi troubl ye the
woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

26:11 for ye have the poor alway with you; but me ye have not always.

26:12 for in that she hath pour thi ointment on my body, she did it
for my burial.

26:13 verili I say unto you, wheresoev thi gospel shall be preached
in the whole world, there shall also this, that thi woman hath done,
b told for a memori of her.

26:14 then one of the twelve, call juda iscariot, went unto the
chief priests, 26:15 and said unto them, what will ye give me, and i
wil deliv him unto you? and they coven with him for thirty
piec of silver.

26:16 and from that time he sought opportun to betray him.

26:17 now the first day of the feast of unleaven bread the disciples
cam to jesus, say unto him, where wilt thou that we prepar for
the to eat the passover?  26:18 and he said, Go into the citi to such
a man, and say unto him, the master saith, My time is at hand; I will
keep the passov at thi hous with my disciples.

26:19 and the discipl did as jesu had appoint them; and they made
readi the passover.

26:20 now when the even wa come, he sat down with the twelve.

26:21 and as they did eat, he said, verili I say unto you, that one of
you shall betray me.

26:22 and they were exceed sorrowful, and began everi one of them
to say unto him, lord, is it I?  26:23 and he answer and said, he
that dippeth hi hand with me in the dish, the same shall betray me.

26:24 the son of man goeth as it is written of him: but woe unto that
man by whom the son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man
if he had not been born.

26:25 then judas, which betray him, answer and said, master, is it
i?  He said unto him, thou hast said.

26:26 and as they were eating, jesu took bread, and bless it, and
brak it, and gave it to the disciples, and said, take, eat; thi is
mi body.

26:27 and he took the cup, and gave thanks, and gave it to them,
saying, drink ye all of it; 26:28 for thi is my blood of the new
testament, which is shed for mani for the remiss of sins.

26:29 but I say unto you, I will not drink henceforth of thi fruit of
th vine, until that day when I drink it new with you in my father's
kingdom.

26:30 and when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of
olives.

26:31 then saith jesu unto them, all ye shall be offend becaus of
m thi night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the
sheep of the flock shall be scatter abroad.

26:32 but after I am risen again, I will go befor you into galilee.

26:33 peter answer and said unto him, though all men shall be
offend becaus of thee, yet will I never be offended.

26:34 jesu said unto him, verili I say unto thee, that thi night,
befor the cock crow, thou shalt deni me thrice.

26:35 peter said unto him, though I should die with thee, yet will i
not deni thee. likewis also said all the disciples.

26:36 then cometh jesu with them unto a place call gethsemane, and
saith unto the disciples, sit ye here, while I go and pray yonder.

26:37 and he took with him peter and the two son of zebedee, and
began to be sorrow and veri heavy.

26:38 then saith he unto them, My soul is exceed sorrowful, even
unto death: tarri ye here, and watch with me.

26:39 and he went a littl farther, and fell on hi face, and prayed,
saying, O my father, if it be possible, let thi cup pass from me:
nevertheless not as I will, but as thou wilt.

26:40 and he cometh unto the disciples, and findeth them asleep, and
saith unto peter, what, could ye not watch with me one hour?  26:41
watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed
i willing, but the flesh is weak.

26:42 He went away again the second time, and prayed, saying, O my
father, if thi cup may not pass away from me, except I drink it, thy
wil be done.

26:43 and he came and found them asleep again: for their eye were
heavy.

26:44 and he left them, and went away again, and pray the third
time, say the same words.

26:45 then cometh he to hi disciples, and saith unto them, sleep on
now, and take your rest: behold, the hour is at hand, and the son of
man is betray into the hand of sinners.

26:46 rise, let us be going: behold, he is at hand that doth betray
me.

26:47 and while he yet spake, lo, judas, one of the twelve, came, and
with him a great multitud with sword and staves, from the chief
priest and elder of the people.

26:48 now he that betray him gave them a sign, saying, whomsoev i
shal kiss, that same is he: hold him fast.

26:49 and forthwith he came to jesus, and said, hail, master; and
kiss him.

26:50 and jesu said unto him, friend, wherefor art thou come? then
cam they, and laid hand on jesu and took him.

26:51 and, behold, one of them which were with jesu stretch out his
hand, and drew hi sword, and struck a servant of the high priest's,
and smote off hi ear.

26:52 then said jesu unto him, put up again thi sword into hi place:
for all they that take the sword shall perish with the sword.

26:53 thinkest thou that I cannot now pray to my father, and he shall
pres give me more than twelv legion of angels?  26:54 but how
then shall the scriptur be fulfilled, that thu it must be?  26:55
in that same hour said jesu to the multitudes, are ye come out as
against a thief with sword and stave for to take me? I sat daily
with you teach in the temple, and ye laid no hold on me.

26:56 but all thi wa done, that the scriptur of the prophet might
b fulfilled. then all the discipl forsook him, and fled.

26:57 and they that had laid hold on jesu led him away to caiaphas
th high priest, where the scribe and the elder were assembled.

26:58 but peter follow him afar off unto the high priest' palace,
and went in, and sat with the servants, to see the end.

26:59 now the chief priests, and elders, and all the council, sought
fals wit against jesus, to put him to death; 26:60 but found
none: yea, though mani fals wit came, yet found they none. at
th last came two fals witnesses, 26:61 and said, thi fellow said, i
am abl to destroy the templ of god, and to build it in three days.

26:62 and the high priest arose, and said unto him, answerest thou
nothing? what is it which these wit against thee?  26:63 but jesus
held hi peace, and the high priest answer and said unto him, i
adjur thee by the live god, that thou tell us whether thou be the
christ, the son of god.

26:64 jesu saith unto him, thou hast said: nevertheless I say unto
you, hereaft shall ye see the son of man sit on the right hand
of power, and come in the cloud of heaven.

26:65 then the high priest rent hi clothes, saying, He hath spoken
blasphemy; what further need have we of witnesses? behold, now ye have
heard hi blasphemy.

26:66 what think ye? they answer and said, He is guilti of death.

26:67 then did they spit in hi face, and buffet him; and others
smot him with the palm of their hands, 26:68 saying, prophesi unto
us, thou christ, who is he that smote thee?  26:69 now peter sat
without in the palace: and a damsel came unto him, saying, thou also
wast with jesu of galilee.

26:70 but he deni befor them all, saying, I know not what thou
sayest.

26:71 and when he wa gone out into the porch, anoth maid saw him,
and said unto them that were there, thi fellow wa also with jesu of
nazareth.

26:72 and again he deni with an oath, I do not know the man.

26:73 and after a while came unto him they that stood by, and said to
peter, sure thou also art one of them; for thi speech bewrayeth
thee.

26:74 then began he to curs and to swear, saying, I know not the man.
and immedi the cock crew.

26:75 and peter rememb the word of jesus, which said unto him,
befor the cock crow, thou shalt deni me thrice. and he went out, and
wept bitterly.

27:1 when the morn wa come, all the chief priest and elder of
th peopl took counsel against jesu to put him to death: 27:2 and
when they had bound him, they led him away, and deliv him to
pontiu pilat the governor.

27:3 then judas, which had betray him, when he saw that he was
condemned, repent himself, and brought again the thirti piec of
silv to the chief priest and elders, 27:4 saying, I have sin in
that I have betray the innoc blood. and they said, what is that
to us? see thou to that.

27:5 and he cast down the piec of silver in the temple, and
departed, and went and hang himself.

27:6 and the chief priest took the silver pieces, and said, It is not
law for to put them into the treasury, becaus it is the price of
blood.

27:7 and they took counsel, and bought with them the potter' field,
to buri stranger in.

27:8 wherefor that field wa called, the field of blood, unto this
day.

27:9 then wa fulfil that which wa spoken by jeremi the prophet,
saying, and they took the thirti piec of silver, the price of him
that wa valued, whom they of the children of israel did value; 27:10
and gave them for the potter' field, as the lord appoint me.

27:11 and jesu stood befor the governor: and the governor ask him,
saying, art thou the king of the jews? and jesu said unto him, thou
sayest.

27:12 and when he wa accus of the chief priest and elders, he
answ nothing.

27:13 then said pilat unto him, hearest thou not how mani thing they
wit against thee?  27:14 and he answer him to never a word;
insomuch that the governor marvel greatly.

27:15 now at that feast the governor wa wont to releas unto the
peopl a prisoner, whom they would.

27:16 and they had then a notabl prisoner, call barabbas.

27:17 therefor when they were gather together, pilat said unto
them, whom will ye that I releas unto you? barabbas, or jesu which
i call christ?  27:18 for he knew that for envi they had delivered
him.

27:19 when he wa set down on the judgment seat, hi wife sent unto
him, saying, have thou noth to do with that just man: for I have
suff mani thing thi day in a dream becaus of him.

27:20 but the chief priest and elder persuad the multitud that
they should ask barabbas, and destroy jesus.

27:21 the governor answer and said unto them, whether of the twain
wil ye that I releas unto you? they said, barabbas.

27:22 pilat saith unto them, what shall I do then with jesu which is
cal christ? they all say unto him, let him be crucified.

27:23 and the governor said, why, what evil hath he done? but they
cri out the more, saying, let him be crucified.

27:24 when pilat saw that he could prevail nothing, but that rather a
tumult wa made, he took water, and wash hi hand befor the
multitude, saying, I am innoc of the blood of thi just person: see
y to it.

27:25 then answer all the people, and said, hi blood be on us, and
on our children.

27:26 then releas he barabba unto them: and when he had scourged
jesus, he deliv him to be crucified.

27:27 then the soldier of the governor took jesu into the common
hall, and gather unto him the whole band of soldiers.

27:28 and they strip him, and put on him a scarlet robe.

27:29 and when they had plat a crown of thorns, they put it upon
hi head, and a reed in hi right hand: and they bow the knee before
him, and mock him, saying, hail, king of the jews!  27:30 and they
spit upon him, and took the reed, and smote him on the head.

27:31 and after that they had mock him, they took the robe off from
him, and put hi own raiment on him, and led him away to crucifi him.

27:32 and as they came out, they found a man of cyrene, simon by name:
him they compel to bear hi cross.

27:33 and when they were come unto a place call golgotha, that is to
say, a place of a skull, 27:34 they gave him vinegar to drink mingled
with gall: and when he had tast thereof, he would not drink.

27:35 and they crucifi him, and part hi garments, cast lots:
that it might be fulfil which wa spoken by the prophet, they
part my garment among them, and upon my vestur did they cast lots.

27:36 and sit down they watch him there; 27:37 and set up over
hi head hi accus written, thi IS jesu the king OF the jews.

27:38 then were there two thiev crucifi with him, one on the right
hand, and anoth on the left.

27:39 and they that pass by revil him, wag their heads, 27:40
and saying, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three
days, save thyself. If thou be the son of god, come down from the
cross.

27:41 likewis also the chief priest mock him, with the scribes
and elders, said, 27:42 He save others; himself he cannot save. If he
b the king of israel, let him now come down from the cross, and we
wil believ him.

27:43 He trust in god; let him deliv him now, if he will have him:
for he said, I am the son of god.

27:44 the thiev also, which were crucifi with him, cast the same
in hi teeth.

27:45 now from the sixth hour there wa dark over all the land
unto the ninth hour.

27:46 and about the ninth hour jesu cri with a loud voice, saying,
eli, eli, lama sabachthani? that is to say, My god, my god, whi hast
thou forsaken me?  27:47 some of them that stood there, when they
heard that, said, thi man calleth for elias.

27:48 and straightway one of them ran, and took a spunge, and filled
it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him to drink.

27:49 the rest said, let be, let us see whether elia will come to
sav him.

27:50 jesus, when he had cri again with a loud voice, yield up the
ghost.

27:51 and, behold, the veil of the templ wa rent in twain from the
top to the bottom; and the earth did quake, and the rock rent; 27:52
and the grave were opened; and mani bodi of the saint which slept
arose, 27:53 and came out of the grave after hi resurrection, and
went into the holi city, and appear unto many.

27:54 now when the centurion, and they that were with him, watching
jesus, saw the earthquake, and those thing that were done, they
fear greatly, saying, truli thi wa the son of god.

27:55 and mani women were there behold afar off, which followed
jesu from galilee, minist unto him: 27:56 among which wa mary
magdalene, and mari the mother of jame and joses, and the mother of
zebede children.

27:57 when the even wa come, there came a rich man of arimathaea,
nam joseph, who also himself wa jesus' disciple: 27:58 He went to
pilate, and beg the bodi of jesus. then pilat command the body
to be delivered.

27:59 and when joseph had taken the body, he wrap it in a clean
linen cloth, 27:60 and laid it in hi own new tomb, which he had hewn
out in the rock: and he roll a great stone to the door of the
sepulchre, and departed.

27:61 and there wa mari magdalene, and the other mary, sit over
against the sepulchre.

27:62 now the next day, that follow the day of the preparation, the
chief priest and pharise came togeth unto pilate, 27:63 saying,
sir, we rememb that that deceiv said, while he wa yet alive,
aft three day I will rise again.

27:64 command therefor that the sepulchr be made sure until the
third day, lest hi discipl come by night, and steal him away, and
say unto the people, He is risen from the dead: so the last error
shal be wors than the first.

27:65 pilat said unto them, Ye have a watch: go your way, make it as
sur as ye can.

27:66 So they went, and made the sepulchr sure, seal the stone,
and set a watch.

28:1 In the end of the sabbath, as it began to dawn toward the first
day of the week, came mari magdalen and the other mari to see the
sepulchre.

28:2 and, behold, there wa a great earthquake: for the angel of the
lord descend from heaven, and came and roll back the stone from
th door, and sat upon it.

28:3 hi counten wa like lightning, and hi raiment white as
snow: 28:4 and for fear of him the keeper did shake, and becam as
dead men.

28:5 and the angel answer and said unto the women, fear not ye: for
i know that ye seek jesus, which wa crucified.

28:6 He is not here: for he is risen, as he said. come, see the place
wher the lord lay.

28:7 and go quickly, and tell hi discipl that he is risen from the
dead; and, behold, he goeth befor you into galilee; there shall ye
se him: lo, I have told you.

28:8 and they depart quickli from the sepulchr with fear and great
joy; and did run to bring hi discipl word.

28:9 and as they went to tell hi disciples, behold, jesu met them,
saying, all hail. and they came and held him by the feet, and
worship him.

28:10 then said jesu unto them, Be not afraid: go tell my brethren
that they go into galilee, and there shall they see me.

28:11 now when they were going, behold, some of the watch came into
th city, and shew unto the chief priest all the thing that were
done.

28:12 and when they were assembl with the elders, and had taken
counsel, they gave larg money unto the soldiers, 28:13 saying, say
ye, hi discipl came by night, and stole him away while we slept.

28:14 and if thi come to the governor' ears, we will persuad him,
and secur you.

28:15 So they took the money, and did as they were taught: and this
say is commonli report among the jew until thi day.

28:16 then the eleven discipl went away into galilee, into a
mountain where jesu had appoint them.

28:17 and when they saw him, they worship him: but some doubted.

28:18 and jesu came and spake unto them, saying, all power is given
unto me in heaven and in earth.

28:19 Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptiz them in the
nam of the father, and of the son, and of the holi ghost: 28:20
teach them to observ all thing whatsoev I have command you:
and, lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world. amen.




th gospel accord to saint mark


1:1 the begin of the gospel of jesu christ, the son of god; 1:2
a it is written in the prophets, behold, I send my messeng before
thi face, which shall prepar thi way befor thee.

1:3 the voic of one cri in the wilderness, prepar ye the way of
th lord, make hi path straight.

1:4 john did baptiz in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of
repent for the remiss of sins.

1:5 and there went out unto him all the land of judaea, and they of
jerusalem, and were all baptiz of him in the river of jordan,
confess their sins.

1:6 and john wa cloth with camel' hair, and with a girdl of a
skin about hi loins; and he did eat locust and wild honey; 1:7 and
preached, saying, there cometh one mightier than I after me, the
latchet of whose shoe I am not worthi to stoop down and unloose.

1:8 I inde have baptiz you with water: but he shall baptiz you
with the holi ghost.

1:9 and it came to pass in those days, that jesu came from nazareth
of galilee, and wa baptiz of john in jordan.

1:10 and straightway come up out of the water, he saw the heavens
opened, and the spirit like a dove descend upon him: 1:11 and there
cam a voic from heaven, saying, thou art my belov son, in whom i
am well pleased.

1:12 and immedi the spirit driveth him into the wilderness.

1:13 and he wa there in the wilder forti days, tempt of satan;
and wa with the wild beasts; and the angel minist unto him.

1:14 now after that john wa put in prison, jesu came into galilee,
preach the gospel of the kingdom of god, 1:15 and saying, the time
i fulfilled, and the kingdom of god is at hand: repent ye, and
believ the gospel.

1:16 now as he walk by the sea of galilee, he saw simon and andrew
hi brother cast a net into the sea: for they were fishers.

1:17 and jesu said unto them, come ye after me, and I will make you
to becom fisher of men.

1:18 and straightway they forsook their nets, and follow him.

1:19 and when he had gone a littl farther thence, he saw jame the
son of zebedee, and john hi brother, who also were in the ship
mend their nets.

1:20 and straightway he call them: and they left their father
zebede in the ship with the hire servants, and went after him.

1:21 and they went into capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day
h enter into the synagogue, and taught.

1:22 and they were astonish at hi doctrine: for he taught them as
on that had authority, and not as the scribes.

1:23 and there wa in their synagogu a man with an unclean spirit;
and he cri out, 1:24 saying, let us alone; what have we to do with
thee, thou jesu of nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee
who thou art, the holi one of god.

1:25 and jesu rebuk him, saying, hold thi peace, and come out of
him.

1:26 and when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cri with a loud
voice, he came out of him.

1:27 and they were all amazed, insomuch that they question among
themselves, saying, what thing is this? what new doctrin is this? for
with author commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do
obey him.

1:28 and immedi hi fame spread abroad throughout all the region
round about galilee.

1:29 and forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they
ent into the hous of simon and andrew, with jame and john.

1:30 but simon' wife' mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell
