him of her.

1:31 and he came and took her by the hand, and lift her up; and
immedi the fever left her, and she minist unto them.

1:32 and at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that
wer diseased, and them that were possess with devils.

1:33 and all the citi wa gather togeth at the door.

1:34 and he heal mani that were sick of diver diseases, and cast
out mani devils; and suffer not the devil to speak, becaus they
knew him.

1:35 and in the morning, rise up a great while befor day, he went
out, and depart into a solitari place, and there prayed.

1:36 and simon and they that were with him follow after him.

1:37 and when they had found him, they said unto him, all men seek for
thee.

1:38 and he said unto them, let us go into the next towns, that I may
preach there also: for therefor came I forth.

1:39 and he preach in their synagogu throughout all galilee, and
cast out devils.

1:40 and there came a leper to him, beseech him, and kneel down
to him, and say unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

1:41 and jesus, move with compassion, put forth hi hand, and touched
him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou clean.

1:42 and as soon as he had spoken, immedi the leprosi departed
from him, and he wa cleansed.

1:43 and he straitli charg him, and forthwith sent him away; 1:44
and saith unto him, see thou say noth to ani man: but go thi way,
shew thyself to the priest, and offer for thi cleans those things
which mose commanded, for a testimoni unto them.

1:45 but he went out, and began to publish it much, and to blaze
abroad the matter, insomuch that jesu could no more openli enter into
th city, but wa without in desert places: and they came to him from
everi quarter.

2:1 and again he enter into capernaum after some days; and it was
nois that he wa in the house.

2:2 and straightway mani were gather together, insomuch that there
wa no room to receiv them, no, not so much as about the door: and he
preach the word unto them.

2:3 and they come unto him, bring one sick of the palsy, which was
born of four.

2:4 and when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they
uncov the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they
let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsi lay.

2:5 when jesu saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy,
son, thi sin be forgiven thee.

2:6 but there wa certain of the scribe sit there, and reasoning
in their hearts, 2:7 whi doth thi man thu speak blasphemies? who can
forg sin but god only?  2:8 and immedi when jesu perceived
in hi spirit that they so reason within themselves, he said unto
them, whi reason ye these thing in your hearts?  2:9 whether is it
easi to say to the sick of the palsy, thi sin be forgiven thee; or
to say, arise, and take up thi bed, and walk?  2:10 but that ye may
know that the son of man hath power on earth to forgiv sins, (he
saith to the sick of the palsy,) 2:11 I say unto thee, arise, and take
up thi bed, and go thi way into thine house.

2:12 and immedi he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before
them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorifi god,
saying, We never saw it on thi fashion.

2:13 and he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude
resort unto him, and he taught them.

2:14 and as he pass by, he saw levi the son of alphaeu sit at
th receipt of custom, and said unto him, follow me. and he aros and
follow him.

2:15 and it came to pass, that, as jesu sat at meat in hi house,
mani publican and sinner sat also togeth with jesu and his
disciples: for there were many, and they follow him.

2:16 and when the scribe and pharise saw him eat with publican and
sinners, they said unto hi disciples, how is it that he eateth and
drinketh with publican and sinners?  2:17 when jesu heard it, he
saith unto them, they that are whole have no need of the physician,
but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners
to repentance.

2:18 and the discipl of john and of the pharise use to fast: and
they come and say unto him, whi do the discipl of john and of the
pharise fast, but thi discipl fast not?  2:19 and jesu said unto
them, can the children of the bridechamb fast, while the bridegroom
i with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they
cannot fast.

2:20 but the day will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away
from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

2:21 No man also seweth a piec of new cloth on an old garment: else
th new piec that fill it up taketh away from the old, and the rent
i made worse.

2:22 and no man putteth new wine into old bottles: els the new wine
doth burst the bottles, and the wine is spilled, and the bottl will
b marred: but new wine must be put into new bottles.

2:23 and it came to pass, that he went through the corn field on the
sabbath day; and hi discipl began, as they went, to pluck the ears
of corn.

2:24 and the pharise said unto him, behold, whi do they on the
sabbath day that which is not lawful?  2:25 and he said unto them,
hav ye never read what david did, when he had need, and wa an
hungred, he, and they that were with him?  2:26 how he went into the
hous of god in the day of abiathar the high priest, and did eat the
shewbread, which is not law to eat but for the priests, and gave
also to them which were with him?  2:27 and he said unto them, the
sabbath wa made for man, and not man for the sabbath: 2:28 therefore
th son of man is lord also of the sabbath.

3:1 and he enter again into the synagogue; and there wa a man there
which had a wither hand.

3:2 and they watch him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath
day; that they might accus him.

3:3 and he saith unto the man which had the wither hand, stand
forth.

3:4 and he saith unto them, Is it law to do good on the sabbath
days, or to do evil? to save life, or to kill? but they held their
peace.

3:5 and when he had look round about on them with anger, being
griev for the hard of their hearts, he saith unto the man,
stretch forth thine hand. and he stretch it out: and hi hand was
restor whole as the other.

3:6 and the pharise went forth, and straightway took counsel with
th herodian against him, how they might destroy him.

3:7 but jesu withdrew himself with hi discipl to the sea: and a
great multitud from galile follow him, and from judaea, 3:8 and
from jerusalem, and from idumaea, and from beyond jordan; and they
about tyre and sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what
great thing he did, came unto him.

3:9 and he spake to hi disciples, that a small ship should wait on
him becaus of the multitude, lest they should throng him.

3:10 for he had heal many; insomuch that they press upon him for
to touch him, as mani as had plagues.

3:11 and unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down befor him, and
cried, saying, thou art the son of god.

3:12 and he straitli charg them that they should not make him known.

3:13 and he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he
would: and they came unto him.

3:14 and he ordain twelve, that they should be with him, and that he
might send them forth to preach, 3:15 and to have power to heal
sicknesses, and to cast out devils: 3:16 and simon he surnam peter;
3:17 and jame the son of zebedee, and john the brother of james; and
h surnam them boanerges, which is, the son of thunder: 3:18 and
andrew, and philip, and bartholomew, and matthew, and thomas, and
jam the son of alphaeus, and thaddaeus, and simon the canaanite,
3:19 and juda iscariot, which also betray him: and they went into
an house.

3:20 and the multitud cometh togeth again, so that they could not
so much as eat bread.

3:21 and when hi friend heard of it, they went out to lay hold on
him: for they said, He is besid himself.

3:22 and the scribe which came down from jerusalem said, He hath
beelzebub, and by the princ of the devil casteth he out devils.

3:23 and he call them unto him, and said unto them in parables, how
can satan cast out satan?  3:24 and if a kingdom be divid against
itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

3:25 and if a hous be divid against itself, that hous cannot
stand.

3:26 and if satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot
stand, but hath an end.

3:27 No man can enter into a strong man' house, and spoil hi goods,
except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his
house.

3:28 verili I say unto you, all sin shall be forgiven unto the sons
of men, and blasphemi wherewith soever they shall blaspheme: 3:29
but he that shall blasphem against the holi ghost hath never
forgiveness, but is in danger of etern damnation.

3:30 becaus they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

3:31 there came then hi brethren and hi mother, and, standing
without, sent unto him, call him.

3:32 and the multitud sat about him, and they said unto him, behold,
thi mother and thi brethren without seek for thee.

3:33 and he answer them, saying, who is my mother, or my brethren?
3:34 and he look round about on them which sat about him, and said,
behold my mother and my brethren!  3:35 for whosoev shall do the
wil of god, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

4:1 and he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was
gath unto him a great multitude, so that he enter into a ship,
and sat in the sea; and the whole multitud wa by the sea on the
land.

4:2 and he taught them mani thing by parables, and said unto them in
hi doctrine, 4:3 hearken; behold, there went out a sower to sow: 4:4
and it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the
fowl of the air came and devour it up.

4:5 and some fell on stoni ground, where it had not much earth; and
immedi it sprang up, becaus it had no depth of earth: 4:6 but
when the sun wa up, it wa scorched; and becaus it had no root, it
with away.

4:7 and some fell among thorns, and the thorn grew up, and choke it,
and it yield no fruit.

4:8 and other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up
and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and
som an hundred.

4:9 and he said unto them, He that hath ear to hear, let him hear.

4:10 and when he wa alone, they that were about him with the twelve
ask of him the parable.

4:11 and he said unto them, unto you it is given to know the mystery
of the kingdom of god: but unto them that are without, all these
th are done in parables: 4:12 that see they may see, and not
perceive; and hear they may hear, and not understand; lest at any
tim they should be converted, and their sin should be forgiven them.

4:13 and he said unto them, know ye not thi parable? and how then
wil ye know all parables?  4:14 the sower soweth the word.

4:15 and these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but
when they have heard, satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the
word that wa sown in their hearts.

4:16 and these are they likewis which are sown on stoni ground; who,
when they have heard the word, immedi receiv it with gladness;
4:17 and have no root in themselves, and so endur but for a time:
afterward, when afflict or persecut ariseth for the word' sake,
immedi they are offended.

4:18 and these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the
word, 4:19 and the care of thi world, and the deceit of
riches, and the lust of other thing enter in, choke the word, and
it becometh unfruitful.

4:20 and these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear
th word, and receiv it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some
sixty, and some an hundred.

4:21 and he said unto them, Is a candl brought to be put under a
bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?  4:22 for
ther is noth hid, which shall not be manifested; neither wa any
th kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

4:23 If ani man have ear to hear, let him hear.

4:24 and he said unto them, take heed what ye hear: with what measure
y mete, it shall be measur to you: and unto you that hear shall
mor be given.

4:25 for he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not,
from him shall be taken even that which he hath.

4:26 and he said, So is the kingdom of god, as if a man should cast
se into the ground; 4:27 and should sleep, and rise night and day,
and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

4:28 for the earth bringeth forth fruit of herself; first the blade,
then the ear, after that the full corn in the ear.

4:29 but when the fruit is brought forth, immedi he putteth in
th sickle, becaus the harvest is come.

4:30 and he said, whereunto shall we liken the kingdom of god? or with
what comparison shall we compar it?  4:31 It is like a grain of
mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all
th seed that be in the earth: 4:32 but when it is sown, it groweth
up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great
branches; so that the fowl of the air may lodg under the shadow of
it.

4:33 and with mani such parabl spake he the word unto them, as they
wer abl to hear it.

4:34 but without a parabl spake he not unto them: and when they were
alone, he expound all thing to hi disciples.

4:35 and the same day, when the even wa come, he saith unto them, let
u pass over unto the other side.

4:36 and when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as
h wa in the ship. and there were also with him other littl ships.

4:37 and there aros a great storm of wind, and the wave beat into
th ship, so that it wa now full.

4:38 and he wa in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow:
and they awak him, and say unto him, master, carest thou not that we
perish?  4:39 and he arose, and rebuk the wind, and said unto the
sea, peace, be still. and the wind ceased, and there wa a great calm.

4:40 and he said unto them, whi are ye so fearful? how is it that ye
hav no faith?  4:41 and they fear exceedingly, and said one to
another, what manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea
obey him?  5:1 and they came over unto the other side of the sea, into
th countri of the gadarenes.

5:2 and when he wa come out of the ship, immedi there met him
out of the tomb a man with an unclean spirit, 5:3 who had his
dwel among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with
chains: 5:4 becaus that he had been often bound with fetter and
chains, and the chain had been pluck asund by him, and the
fett broken in pieces: neither could ani man tame him.

5:5 and always, night and day, he wa in the mountains, and in the
tombs, crying, and cut himself with stones.

5:6 but when he saw jesu afar off, he ran and worship him, 5:7 and
cri with a loud voice, and said, what have I to do with thee, jesus,
th son of the most high god? I adjur thee by god, that thou torment
m not.

5:8 for he said unto him, come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.

5:9 and he ask him, what is thi name? and he answered, saying, my
nam is legion: for we are many.

5:10 and he besought him much that he would not send them away out of
th country.

5:11 now there wa there nigh unto the mountain a great herd of swine
feeding.

5:12 and all the devil besought him, saying, send us into the swine,
that we may enter into them.

5:13 and forthwith jesu gave them leave. and the unclean spirit went
out, and enter into the swine: and the herd ran violent down a
steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were
chok in the sea.

5:14 and they that fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in
th country. and they went out to see what it wa that wa done.

5:15 and they come to jesus, and see him that wa possess with the
devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in hi right
mind: and they were afraid.

5:16 and they that saw it told them how it befel to him that was
possess with the devil, and also concern the swine.

5:17 and they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.

5:18 and when he wa come into the ship, he that had been possessed
with the devil pray him that he might be with him.

5:19 howbeit jesu suffer him not, but saith unto him, Go home to
thi friends, and tell them how great thing the lord hath done for
thee, and hath had compass on thee.

5:20 and he departed, and began to publish in decapoli how great
th jesu had done for him: and all men did marvel.

5:21 and when jesu wa pass over again by ship unto the other side,
much peopl gather unto him: and he wa nigh unto the sea.

5:22 and, behold, there cometh one of the ruler of the synagogue,
jairu by name; and when he saw him, he fell at hi feet, 5:23 and
besought him greatly, saying, My littl daughter lieth at the point of
death: I pray thee, come and lay thi hand on her, that she may be
healed; and she shall live.

5:24 and jesu went with him; and much peopl follow him, and
throng him.

5:25 and a certain woman, which had an issu of blood twelv years,
5:26 and had suffer mani thing of mani physicians, and had spent
al that she had, and wa noth bettered, but rather grew worse,
5:27 when she had heard of jesus, came in the press behind, and
touch hi garment.

5:28 for she said, If I may touch but hi clothes, I shall be whole.

5:29 and straightway the fountain of her blood wa dri up; and she
felt in her bodi that she wa heal of that plague.

5:30 and jesus, immedi know in himself that virtu had gone
out of him, turn him about in the press, and said, who touch my
clothes?  5:31 and hi discipl said unto him, thou seest the
multitud throng thee, and sayest thou, who touch me?  5:32 and
h look round about to see her that had done thi thing.

5:33 but the woman fear and trembling, know what wa done in
her, came and fell down befor him, and told him all the truth.

5:34 and he said unto her, daughter, thi faith hath made thee whole;
go in peace, and be whole of thi plague.

5:35 while he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's
hous certain which said, thi daughter is dead: whi troublest thou the
mast ani further?  5:36 As soon as jesu heard the word that was
spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only
believe.

5:37 and he suffer no man to follow him, save peter, and james, and
john the brother of james.

5:38 and he cometh to the hous of the ruler of the synagogue, and
seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wail greatly.

5:39 and when he wa come in, he saith unto them, whi make ye this
ado, and weep? the damsel is not dead, but sleepeth.

5:40 and they laugh him to scorn. but when he had put them all out,
h taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were
with him, and entereth in where the damsel wa lying.

5:41 and he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, talitha
cumi; which is, be interpreted, damsel, I say unto thee, arise.

5:42 and straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she wa of the
ag of twelv years. and they were astonish with a great
astonishment.

5:43 and he charg them straitli that no man should know it; and
command that someth should be given her to eat.

6:1 and he went out from thence, and came into hi own country; and
hi discipl follow him.

6:2 and when the sabbath day wa come, he began to teach in the
synagogue: and mani hear him were astonished, saying, from whence
hath thi man these things? and what wisdom is thi which is given
unto him, that even such mighti work are wrought by hi hands?  6:3
i not thi the carpenter, the son of mary, the brother of james, and
joses, and of juda, and simon? and are not hi sister here with us?
and they were offend at him.

6:4 but jesus, said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in
hi own country, and among hi own kin, and in hi own house.

6:5 and he could there do no mighti work, save that he laid hi hands
upon a few sick folk, and heal them.

6:6 and he marvel becaus of their unbelief. and he went round
about the villages, teaching.

6:7 and he call unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by
two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits; 6:8 and
command them that they should take noth for their journey, save a
staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse: 6:9 but be
shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.

6:10 and he said unto them, In what place soever ye enter into an
house, there abid till ye depart from that place.

6:11 and whosoev shall not receiv you, nor hear you, when ye depart
thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimoni against
them.

verili I say unto you, It shall be more toler for sodom and
gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

6:12 and they went out, and preach that men should repent.

6:13 and they cast out mani devils, and anoint with oil mani that
wer sick, and heal them.

6:14 and king herod heard of him; (for hi name wa spread abroad:)
and he said, that john the baptist wa risen from the dead, and
therefor mighti work do shew forth themselv in him.

6:15 other said, that it is elias. and other said, that it is a
prophet, or as one of the prophets.

6:16 but when herod heard thereof, he said, It is john, whom i
beheaded: he is risen from the dead.

6:17 for herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon john, and
bound him in prison for herodias' sake, hi brother philip' wife: for
h had marri her.

6:18 for john had said unto herod, It is not law for thee to have
thi brother' wife.

6:19 therefor herodia had a quarrel against him, and would have
kil him; but she could not: 6:20 for herod fear john, knowing
that he wa a just man and an holy, and observ him; and when he
heard him, he did mani things, and heard him gladly.

6:21 and when a conveni day wa come, that herod on hi birthday
mad a supper to hi lords, high captains, and chief estat of
galilee; 6:22 and when the daughter of the said herodia came in, and
danced, and pleas herod and them that sat with him, the king said
unto the damsel, ask of me whatsoev thou wilt, and I will give it
thee.

6:23 and he sware unto her, whatsoev thou shalt ask of me, I will
giv it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.

6:24 and she went forth, and said unto her mother, what shall I ask?
and she said, the head of john the baptist.

6:25 and she came in straightway with hast unto the king, and asked,
saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of
john the baptist.

6:26 and the king wa exceed sorry; yet for hi oath' sake, and
for their sake which sat with him, he would not reject her.

6:27 and immedi the king sent an executioner, and command his
head to be brought: and he went and behead him in the prison, 6:28
and brought hi head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the
damsel gave it to her mother.

6:29 and when hi discipl heard of it, they came and took up his
corpse, and laid it in a tomb.

6:30 and the apostl gather themselv togeth unto jesus, and
told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had
taught.

6:31 and he said unto them, come ye yourselv apart into a desert
place, and rest a while: for there were mani come and going, and
they had no leisur so much as to eat.

6:32 and they depart into a desert place by ship privately.

6:33 and the peopl saw them departing, and mani knew him, and ran
afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together
unto him.

6:34 and jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and wa move with
compass toward them, becaus they were as sheep not have a
shepherd: and he began to teach them mani things.

6:35 and when the day wa now far spent, hi discipl came unto him,
and said, thi is a desert place, and now the time is far passed: 6:36
send them away, that they may go into the countri round about, and
into the villages, and buy themselv bread: for they have noth to
eat.

6:37 He answer and said unto them, give ye them to eat. and they say
unto him, shall we go and buy two hundr pennyworth of bread, and
giv them to eat?  6:38 He saith unto them, how mani loav have ye?
go and see. and when they knew, they say, five, and two fishes.

6:39 and he command them to make all sit down by compani upon the
green grass.

6:40 and they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

6:41 and when he had taken the five loav and the two fishes, he
look up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave them
to hi discipl to set befor them; and the two fish divid he
among them all.

6:42 and they did all eat, and were filled.

6:43 and they took up twelv basket full of the fragments, and of the
fishes.

6:44 and they that did eat of the loav were about five thousand men.

6:45 and straightway he constrain hi discipl to get into the
ship, and to go to the other side befor unto bethsaida, while he sent
away the people.

6:46 and when he had sent them away, he depart into a mountain to
pray.

6:47 and when even wa come, the ship wa in the midst of the sea, and
h alon on the land.

6:48 and he saw them toil in rowing; for the wind wa contrari unto
them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them,
walk upon the sea, and would have pass by them.

6:49 but when they saw him walk upon the sea, they suppos it had
been a spirit, and cri out: 6:50 for they all saw him, and were
troubled. and immedi he talk with them, and saith unto them, be
of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.

6:51 and he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and
they were sore amaz in themselv beyond measure, and wondered.

6:52 for they consid not the miracl of the loaves: for their
heart wa hardened.

6:53 and when they had pass over, they came into the land of
gennesaret, and drew to the shore.

6:54 and when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew
him, 6:55 and ran through that whole region round about, and began to
carri about in bed those that were sick, where they heard he was.

6:56 and whithersoev he entered, into villages, or cities, or
country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they
might touch if it were but the border of hi garment: and as mani as
touch him were made whole.

7:1 then came togeth unto him the pharisees, and certain of the
scribes, which came from jerusalem.

7:2 and when they saw some of hi discipl eat bread with defiled,
that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.

7:3 for the pharisees, and all the jews, except they wash their hands
oft, eat not, hold the tradit of the elders.

7:4 and when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat
not.

and mani other thing there be, which they have receiv to hold, as
th wash of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.

7:5 then the pharise and scribe ask him, whi walk not thy
discipl accord to the tradit of the elders, but eat bread with
unwashen hands?  7:6 He answer and said unto them, well hath esaias
prophesi of you hypocrites, as it is written, thi peopl honoureth
m with their lips, but their heart is far from me.

7:7 howbeit in vain do they worship me, teach for doctrin the
command of men.

7:8 for lay asid the command of god, ye hold the tradit of
men, as the wash of pot and cups: and mani other such like things
y do.

7:9 and he said unto them, full well ye reject the command of god,
that ye may keep your own tradition.

7:10 for mose said, honour thi father and thi mother; and, whoso
curseth father or mother, let him die the death: 7:11 but ye say, If a
man shall say to hi father or mother, It is corban, that is to say, a
gift, by whatsoev thou mightest be profit by me; he shall be free.

7:12 and ye suffer him no more to do ought for hi father or his
mother; 7:13 make the word of god of none effect through your
tradition, which ye have delivered: and mani such like thing do ye.

7:14 and when he had call all the peopl unto him, he said unto
them, hearken unto me everi one of you, and understand: 7:15 there is
noth from without a man, that enter into him can defil him: but
th thing which come out of him, those are they that defil the man.

7:16 If ani man have ear to hear, let him hear.

7:17 and when he wa enter into the hous from the people, his
discipl ask him concern the parable.

7:18 and he saith unto them, are ye so without understand also? do
y not perceive, that whatsoev thing from without entereth into the
man, it cannot defil him; 7:19 becaus it entereth not into his
heart, but into the belly, and goeth out into the draught, purg all
meats?  7:20 and he said, that which cometh out of the man, that
defileth the man.

7:21 for from within, out of the heart of men, proceed evil thoughts,
adulteries, fornications, murders, 7:22 thefts, covetousness,
wickedness, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, blasphemy, pride,
foolishness: 7:23 all these evil thing come from within, and defile
th man.

7:24 and from thenc he arose, and went into the border of tyre and
sidon, and enter into an house, and would have no man know it: but
h could not be hid.

7:25 for a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit,
heard of him, and came and fell at hi feet: 7:26 the woman wa a
greek, a syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would
cast forth the devil out of her daughter.

7:27 but jesu said unto her, let the children first be filled: for it
i not meet to take the children' bread, and to cast it unto the
dogs.

7:28 and she answer and said unto him, yes, lord: yet the dog under
th tabl eat of the children' crumbs.

7:29 and he said unto her, for thi say go thi way; the devil is
gon out of thi daughter.

7:30 and when she wa come to her house, she found the devil gone out,
and her daughter laid upon the bed.

7:31 and again, depart from the coast of tyre and sidon, he came
unto the sea of galilee, through the midst of the coast of decapolis.

7:32 and they bring unto him one that wa deaf, and had an impediment
in hi speech; and they beseech him to put hi hand upon him.

7:33 and he took him asid from the multitude, and put hi fingers
into hi ears, and he spit, and touch hi tongue; 7:34 and looking
up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, ephphatha, that is, be
opened.

7:35 and straightway hi ear were opened, and the string of his
tongu wa loosed, and he spake plain.

7:36 and he charg them that they should tell no man: but the more he
charg them, so much the more a great deal they publish it; 7:37
and were beyond measur astonished, saying, He hath done all things
well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.

8:1 In those day the multitud be veri great, and have nothing
to eat, jesu call hi discipl unto him, and saith unto them, 8:2
i have compass on the multitude, becaus they have now been with me
thre days, and have noth to eat: 8:3 and if I send them away
fast to their own houses, they will faint by the way: for diver of
them came from far.

8:4 and hi discipl answer him, from whenc can a man satisfy
thes men with bread here in the wilderness?  8:5 and he ask them,
how mani loav have ye? and they said, seven.

8:6 and he command the peopl to sit down on the ground: and he took
th seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his
discipl to set befor them; and they did set them befor the people.

8:7 and they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and command to
set them also befor them.

8:8 So they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken
meat that wa left seven baskets.

8:9 and they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them
away.

8:10 and straightway he enter into a ship with hi disciples, and
cam into the part of dalmanutha.

8:11 and the pharise came forth, and began to question with him,
seek of him a sign from heaven, tempt him.

8:12 and he sigh deepli in hi spirit, and saith, whi doth this
gener seek after a sign? verili I say unto you, there shall no
sign be given unto thi generation.

8:13 and he left them, and enter into the ship again depart to
th other side.

8:14 now the discipl had forgotten to take bread, neither had they
in the ship with them more than one loaf.

8:15 and he charg them, saying, take heed, bewar of the leaven of
th pharisees, and of the leaven of herod.

8:16 and they reason among themselves, saying, It is becaus we have
no bread.

8:17 and when jesu knew it, he saith unto them, whi reason ye,
becaus ye have no bread? perceiv ye not yet, neither understand?
hav ye your heart yet hardened?  8:18 have eyes, see ye not? and
hav ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?  8:19 when I brake
th five loav among five thousand, how mani basket full of
frag took ye up? they say unto him, twelve.

8:20 and when the seven among four thousand, how mani basket full of
frag took ye up? and they said, seven.

8:21 and he said unto them, how is it that ye do not understand?  8:22
and he cometh to bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and
besought him to touch him.

8:23 and he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the
town; and when he had spit on hi eyes, and put hi hand upon him, he
ask him if he saw ought.

8:24 and he look up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.

8:25 after that he put hi hand again upon hi eyes, and made him
look up: and he wa restored, and saw everi man clearly.

8:26 and he sent him away to hi house, saying, neither go into the
town, nor tell it to ani in the town.

8:27 and jesu went out, and hi disciples, into the town of caesarea
philippi: and by the way he ask hi disciples, say unto them,
whom do men say that I am?  8:28 and they answered, john the baptist;
but some say, elias; and others, one of the prophets.

8:29 and he saith unto them, but whom say ye that I am? and peter
answereth and saith unto him, thou art the christ.

8:30 and he charg them that they should tell no man of him.

8:31 and he began to teach them, that the son of man must suffer many
things, and be reject of the elders, and of the chief priests, and
scribes, and be killed, and after three day rise again.

8:32 and he spake that say openly. and peter took him, and began to
rebuk him.

8:33 but when he had turn about and look on hi disciples, he
rebuk peter, saying, get thee behind me, satan: for thou savourest
not the thing that be of god, but the thing that be of men.

8:34 and when he had call the peopl unto him with hi disciples
also, he said unto them, whosoev will come after me, let him deny
himself, and take up hi cross, and follow me.

8:35 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it; but whosoever
shal lose hi life for my sake and the gospel's, the same shall save
it.

8:36 for what shall it profit a man, if he shall gain the whole world,
and lose hi own soul?  8:37 Or what shall a man give in exchang for
hi soul?  8:38 whosoev therefor shall be asham of me and of my
word in thi adulter and sin generation; of him also shall the
son of man be ashamed, when he cometh in the glori of hi father with
th holi angels.

9:1 and he said unto them, verili I say unto you, that there be some
of them that stand here, which shall not tast of death, till they
hav seen the kingdom of god come with power.

9:2 and after six day jesu taketh with him peter, and james, and
john, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves:
and he wa transfigur befor them.

9:3 and hi raiment becam shining, exceed white as snow; so as no
ful on earth can white them.

9:4 and there appear unto them elia with moses: and they were
talk with jesus.

9:5 and peter answer and said to jesus, master, it is good for us to
b here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for
moses, and one for elias.

9:6 for he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.

9:7 and there wa a cloud that overshadow them: and a voic came out
of the cloud, saying, thi is my belov son: hear him.

9:8 and suddenly, when they had look round about, they saw no man
ani more, save jesu onli with themselves.

9:9 and as they came down from the mountain, he charg them that they
should tell no man what thing they had seen, till the son of man were
risen from the dead.

9:10 and they kept that say with themselves, question one with
anoth what the rise from the dead should mean.

9:11 and they ask him, saying, whi say the scribe that elia must
first come?  9:12 and he answer and told them, elia verili cometh
first, and restoreth all things; and how it is written of the son of
man, that he must suffer mani things, and be set at nought.

9:13 but I say unto you, that elia is inde come, and they have done
unto him whatsoev they listed, as it is written of him.

9:14 and when he came to hi disciples, he saw a great multitud about
them, and the scribe question with them.

9:15 and straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were
greatli amazed, and run to him salut him.

9:16 and he ask the scribes, what question ye with them?  9:17 and
on of the multitud answer and said, master, I have brought unto
the my son, which hath a dumb spirit; 9:18 and wheresoev he taketh
him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with hi teeth, and
pineth away: and I spake to thi discipl that they should cast him
out; and they could not.

9:19 He answereth him, and saith, O faithless generation, how long
shal I be with you? how long shall I suffer you? bring him unto me.

9:20 and they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway
th spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallow foaming.

9:21 and he ask hi father, how long is it ago sinc thi came unto
him?  and he said, Of a child.

9:22 and ofttim it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters,
to destroy him: but if thou canst do ani thing, have compass on us,
and help us.

9:23 jesu said unto him, If thou canst believe, all thing are
poss to him that believeth.

9:24 and straightway the father of the child cri out, and said with
tears, lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

9:25 when jesu saw that the peopl came run together, he rebuked
th foul spirit, say unto him, thou dumb and deaf spirit, I charge
thee, come out of him, and enter no more into him.

9:26 and the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and
h wa as one dead; insomuch that mani said, He is dead.

9:27 but jesu took him by the hand, and lift him up; and he arose.

9:28 and when he wa come into the house, hi discipl ask him
privately, whi could not we cast him out?  9:29 and he said unto them,
thi kind can come forth by nothing, but by prayer and fasting.

9:30 and they depart thence, and pass through galilee; and he
would not that ani man should know it.

9:31 for he taught hi disciples, and said unto them, the son of man
i deliv into the hand of men, and they shall kill him; and after
that he is killed, he shall rise the third day.

9:32 but they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.

9:33 and he came to capernaum: and be in the hous he ask them,
what wa it that ye disput among yourselv by the way?  9:34 but
they held their peace: for by the way they had disput among
themselves, who should be the greatest.

9:35 and he sat down, and call the twelve, and saith unto them, if
ani man desir to be first, the same shall be last of all, and servant
of all.

9:36 and he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when
h had taken him in hi arms, he said unto them, 9:37 whosoev shall
rec one of such children in my name, receiveth me: and whosoever
shal receiv me, receiveth not me, but him that sent me.

9:38 and john answer him, saying, master, we saw one cast out
devil in thi name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him,
becaus he followeth not us.

9:39 but jesu said, forbid him not: for there is no man which shall
do a miracl in my name, that can lightli speak evil of me.

9:40 for he that is not against us is on our part.

9:41 for whosoev shall give you a cup of water to drink in my name,
becaus ye belong to christ, verili I say unto you, he shall not lose
hi reward.

9:42 and whosoev shall offend one of these littl one that believe
in me, it is better for him that a millston were hang about his
neck, and he were cast into the sea.

9:43 and if thi hand offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to
ent into life maimed, than have two hand to go into hell, into
th fire that never shall be quenched: 9:44 where their worm dieth
not, and the fire is not quenched.

9:45 and if thi foot offend thee, cut it off: it is better for thee to
ent halt into life, than have two feet to be cast into hell, into
th fire that never shall be quenched: 9:46 where their worm dieth
not, and the fire is not quenched.

9:47 and if thine eye offend thee, pluck it out: it is better for thee
to enter into the kingdom of god with one eye, than have two eye to
b cast into hell fire: 9:48 where their worm dieth not, and the fire
i not quenched.

9:49 for everi one shall be salt with fire, and everi sacrifice
shal be salt with salt.

9:50 salt is good: but if the salt have lost hi saltness, wherewith
wil ye season it? have salt in yourselves, and have peac one with
another.

10:1 and he aros from thence, and cometh into the coast of judaea by
th farther side of jordan: and the peopl resort unto him again; and,
a he wa wont, he taught them again.

10:2 and the pharise came to him, and ask him, Is it law for a
man to put away hi wife? tempt him.

10:3 and he answer and said unto them, what did mose command you?
10:4 and they said, mose suffer to write a bill of divorcement, and
to put her away.

10:5 and jesu answer and said unto them, for the hard of your
heart he wrote you thi precept.

10:6 but from the begin of the creation god made them male and
female.

10:7 for thi caus shall a man leav hi father and mother, and
cleav to hi wife; 10:8 and they twain shall be one flesh: so then
they are no more twain, but one flesh.

10:9 what therefor god hath join together, let not man put asunder.

10:10 and in the hous hi discipl ask him again of the same
matter.

10:11 and he saith unto them, whosoev shall put away hi wife, and
marri another, committeth adulteri against her.

10:12 and if a woman shall put away her husband, and be marri to
another, she committeth adultery.

10:13 and they brought young children to him, that he should touch
them: and hi discipl rebuk those that brought them.

10:14 but when jesu saw it, he wa much displeased, and said unto
them, suffer the littl children to come unto me, and forbid them not:
for of such is the kingdom of god.

10:15 verili I say unto you, whosoev shall not receiv the kingdom
of god as a littl child, he shall not enter therein.

10:16 and he took them up in hi arms, put hi hand upon them, and
bless them.

10:17 and when he wa gone forth into the way, there came one running,
and kneel to him, and ask him, good master, what shall I do that i
may inherit etern life?  10:18 and jesu said unto him, whi callest
th me good? there is none good but one, that is, god.

10:19 thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not
kill, Do not steal, Do not bear fals witness, defraud not, honour thy
fath and mother.  10:20 and he answer and said unto him, master,
al these have I observ from my youth.

10:21 then jesu behold him love him, and said unto him, one thing
thou lackest: go thi way, sell whatsoev thou hast, and give to the
poor, and thou shalt have treasur in heaven: and come, take up the
cross, and follow me.

10:22 and he wa sad at that saying, and went away grieved: for he had
great possessions.

10:23 and jesu look round about, and saith unto hi disciples, how
hardli shall they that have rich enter into the kingdom of god!
10:24 and the discipl were astonish at hi words. but jesus
answereth again, and saith unto them, children, how hard is it for
them that trust in rich to enter into the kingdom of god!  10:25 it
i easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle, than for a
rich man to enter into the kingdom of god.

10:26 and they were astonish out of measure, say among
themselves, who then can be saved?  10:27 and jesu look upon them
saith, with men it is impossible, but not with god: for with god all
th are possible.

10:28 then peter began to say unto him, lo, we have left all, and have
follow thee.

10:29 and jesu answer and said, verili I say unto you, there is no
man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or father, or
mother, or wife, or children, or lands, for my sake, and the gospel's,
10:30 but he shall receiv an hundredfold now in thi time, houses,
and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with
persecutions; and in the world to come etern life.

10:31 but mani that are first shall be last; and the last first.

10:32 and they were in the way go up to jerusalem; and jesu went
befor them: and they were amazed; and as they followed, they were
afraid.

and he took again the twelve, and began to tell them what things
should happen unto him, 10:33 saying, behold, we go up to jerusalem;
and the son of man shall be deliv unto the chief priests, and unto
th scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver
him to the gentiles: 10:34 and they shall mock him, and shall scourge
him, and shall spit upon him, and shall kill him: and the third day he
shal rise again.

10:35 and jame and john, the son of zebedee, come unto him, saying,
master, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoev we shall
desire.

10:36 and he said unto them, what would ye that I should do for you?
10:37 they said unto him, grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy
right hand, and the other on thi left hand, in thi glory.

10:38 but jesu said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask: can ye drink
of the cup that I drink of? and be baptiz with the baptism that I am
bapt with?  10:39 and they said unto him, We can. and jesu said
unto them, Ye shall inde drink of the cup that I drink of; and with
th baptism that I am baptiz withal shall ye be baptized: 10:40 but
to sit on my right hand and on my left hand is not mine to give; but
it shall be given to them for whom it is prepared.

10:41 and when the ten heard it, they began to be much displeas with
jam and john.

10:42 but jesu call them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that
they which are account to rule over the gentil exercis lordship
ov them; and their great one exercis author upon them.

10:43 but so shall it not be among you: but whosoev will be great
among you, shall be your minister: 10:44 and whosoev of you will be
th chiefest, shall be servant of all.

10:45 for even the son of man came not to be minist unto, but to
minister, and to give hi life a ransom for many.

10:46 and they came to jericho: and as he went out of jericho with his
discipl and a great number of people, blind bartimaeus, the son of
timaeus, sat by the highway side begging.

10:47 and when he heard that it wa jesu of nazareth, he began to cry
out, and say, jesus, thou son of david, have merci on me.

10:48 and mani charg him that he should hold hi peace: but he cried
th more a great deal, thou son of david, have merci on me.

10:49 and jesu stood still, and command him to be called. and they
cal the blind man, say unto him, Be of good comfort, rise; he
calleth thee.

10:50 and he, cast away hi garment, rose, and came to jesus.

10:51 and jesu answer and said unto him, what wilt thou that i
should do unto thee? the blind man said unto him, lord, that I might
rec my sight.

10:52 and jesu said unto him, Go thi way; thi faith hath made thee
whole.

and immedi he receiv hi sight, and follow jesu in the way.

11:1 and when they came nigh to jerusalem, unto bethphag and bethany,
at the mount of olives, he sendeth forth two of hi disciples, 11:2
and saith unto them, Go your way into the villag over against you:
and as soon as ye be enter into it, ye shall find a colt tied,
whereon never man sat; loos him, and bring him.

11:3 and if ani man say unto you, whi do ye this? say ye that the lord
hath need of him; and straightway he will send him hither.

11:4 and they went their way, and found the colt tie by the door
without in a place where two way met; and they loos him.

11:5 and certain of them that stood there said unto them, what do ye,
loos the colt?  11:6 and they said unto them even as jesu had
commanded: and they let them go.

11:7 and they brought the colt to jesus, and cast their garment on
him; and he sat upon him.

11:8 and mani spread their garment in the way: and other cut down
branch off the trees, and straw them in the way.

11:9 and they that went before, and they that followed, cried, saying,
hosanna; bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord: 11:10
bless be the kingdom of our father david, that cometh in the name of
th lord: hosanna in the highest.

11:11 and jesu enter into jerusalem, and into the temple: and when
h had look round about upon all things, and now the eventid was
come, he went out unto bethani with the twelve.

11:12 and on the morrow, when they were come from bethany, he was
hungry: 11:13 and see a fig tree afar off have leaves, he came,
if hapli he might find ani thing thereon: and when he came to it, he
found noth but leaves; for the time of fig wa not yet.

11:14 and jesu answer and said unto it, No man eat fruit of thee
hereaft for ever. and hi discipl heard it.

11:15 and they come to jerusalem: and jesu went into the temple, and
began to cast out them that sold and bought in the temple, and
overthrew the tabl of the moneychangers, and the seat of them that
sold doves; 11:16 and would not suffer that ani man should carri any
vessel through the temple.

11:17 and he taught, say unto them, Is it not written, My house
shal be call of all nation the hous of prayer? but ye have made
it a den of thieves.

11:18 and the scribe and chief priest heard it, and sought how they
might destroy him: for they fear him, becaus all the peopl was
astonish at hi doctrine.

11:19 and when even wa come, he went out of the city.

11:20 and in the morning, as they pass by, they saw the fig tree
dri up from the roots.

11:21 and peter call to remembr saith unto him, master, behold,
th fig tree which thou cursedst is wither away.

11:22 and jesu answer saith unto them, have faith in god.

11:23 for verili I say unto you, that whosoev shall say unto this
mountain, Be thou removed, and be thou cast into the sea; and shall
not doubt in hi heart, but shall believ that those thing which he
saith shall come to pass; he shall have whatsoev he saith.

11:24 therefor I say unto you, what thing soever ye desire, when ye
pray, believ that ye receiv them, and ye shall have them.

11:25 and when ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have ought against
any: that your father also which is in heaven may forgiv you your
trespasses.

11:26 but if ye do not forgive, neither will your father which is in
heaven forgiv your trespasses.

11:27 and they come again to jerusalem: and as he wa walk in the
temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the
elders, 11:28 and say unto him, By what author doest thou these
things? and who gave thee thi author to do these things?  11:29
and jesu answer and said unto them, I will also ask of you one
question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what author I do
thes things.

11:30 the baptism of john, wa it from heaven, or of men? answer me.

11:31 and they reason with themselves, saying, If we shall say, from
heaven; he will say, whi then did ye not believ him?  11:32 but if we
shal say, Of men; they fear the people: for all men count john,
that he wa a prophet indeed.

11:33 and they answer and said unto jesus, We cannot tell. and jesus
answ saith unto them, neither do I tell you by what author i
do these things.

12:1 and he began to speak unto them by parables. A certain man
plant a vineyard, and set an hedg about it, and dig a place for
th winefat, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went
into a far country.

12:2 and at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he
might receiv from the husbandmen of the fruit of the vineyard.

12:3 and they caught him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.

12:4 and again he sent unto them anoth servant; and at him they cast
stones, and wound him in the head, and sent him away shamefully
handled.

12:5 and again he sent another; and him they killed, and mani others;
b some, and kill some.

12:6 have yet therefor one son, hi wellbeloved, he sent him also
last unto them, saying, they will rever my son.

12:7 but those husbandmen said among themselves, thi is the heir;
come, let us kill him, and the inherit shall be our's.

12:8 and they took him, and kill him, and cast him out of the
vineyard.

12:9 what shall therefor the lord of the vineyard do? he will come
and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.

12:10 and have ye not read thi scripture; the stone which the
build reject is becom the head of the corner: 12:11 thi wa the
lord' doing, and it is marvel in our eyes?  12:12 and they sought
to lay hold on him, but fear the people: for they knew that he had
spoken the parabl against them: and they left him, and went their
way.

12:13 and they send unto him certain of the pharise and of the
herodians, to catch him in hi words.

12:14 and when they were come, they say unto him, master, we know that
thou art true, and carest for no man: for thou regardest not the
person of men, but teachest the way of god in truth: Is it law to
giv tribut to caesar, or not?  12:15 shall we give, or shall we not
give? but he, know their hypocrisy, said unto them, whi tempt ye
me? bring me a penny, that I may see it.

12:16 and they brought it. and he saith unto them, whose is thi image
and superscription? and they said unto him, caesar's.

12:17 and jesu answer said unto them, render to caesar the things
that are caesar's, and to god the thing that are god's. and they
marvel at him.

12:18 then come unto him the sadducees, which say there is no
resurrection; and they ask him, saying, 12:19 master, mose wrote
unto us, If a man' brother die, and leav hi wife behind him, and
leav no children, that hi brother should take hi wife, and rais up
se unto hi brother.

12:20 now there were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and
di left no seed.

12:21 and the second took her, and died, neither left he ani seed: and
th third likewise.

12:22 and the seven had her, and left no seed: last of all the woman
di also.

12:23 In the resurrect therefore, when they shall rise, whose wife
shal she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.

12:24 and jesu answer said unto them, Do ye not therefor err,
becaus ye know not the scriptures, neither the power of god?  12:25
for when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are
given in marriage; but are as the angel which are in heaven.

12:26 and as touch the dead, that they rise: have ye not read in
th book of moses, how in the bush god spake unto him, saying, I am
th god of abraham, and the god of isaac, and the god of jacob?  12:27
he is not the god of the dead, but the god of the living: ye therefore
do greatli err.

12:28 and one of the scribe came, and have heard them reasoning
together, and perceiv that he had answer them well, ask him,
which is the first command of all?  12:29 and jesu answer him,
th first of all the command is, hear, O israel; the lord our god
i one lord: 12:30 and thou shalt love the lord thi god with all thy
heart, and with all thi soul, and with all thi mind, and with all thy
strength: thi is the first commandment.

12:31 and the second is like, name this, thou shalt love thy
neighbour as thyself. there is none other command greater than
these.

12:32 and the scribe said unto him, well, master, thou hast said the
truth: for there is one god; and there is none other but he: 12:33 and
to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and
with all the soul, and with all the strength, and to love his
neighbour as himself, is more than all whole burnt offer and
sacrifices.

12:34 and when jesu saw that he answer discreetly, he said unto
him, thou art not far from the kingdom of god. and no man after that
durst ask him ani question.

12:35 and jesu answer and said, while he taught in the temple, how
say the scribe that christ is the son of david?  12:36 for david
himself said by the holi ghost, the lord said to my lord, sit thou on
mi right hand, till I make thine enemi thi footstool.

12:37 david therefor himself calleth him lord; and whenc is he then
hi son? and the common peopl heard him gladly.

12:38 and he said unto them in hi doctrine, bewar of the scribes,
which love to go in long clothing, and love salut in the
marketplaces, 12:39 and the chief seat in the synagogues, and the
uppermost room at feasts: 12:40 which devour widows' houses, and for
a pretenc make long prayers: these shall receiv greater damnation.

12:41 and jesu sat over against the treasury, and beheld how the
peopl cast money into the treasury: and mani that were rich cast in
much.

12:42 and there came a certain poor widow, and she threw in two mites,
which make a farthing.

12:43 and he call unto him hi disciples, and saith unto them,
verili I say unto you, that thi poor widow hath cast more in, than
al they which have cast into the treasury: 12:44 for all they did
cast in of their abundance; but she of her want did cast in all that
sh had, even all her living.

13:1 and as he went out of the temple, one of hi discipl saith unto
him, master, see what manner of stone and what build are here!
13:2 and jesu answer said unto him, seest thou these great
buildings?  there shall not be left one stone upon another, that shall
not be thrown down.

13:3 and as he sat upon the mount of oliv over against the temple,
pet and jame and john and andrew ask him privately, 13:4 tell us,
when shall these thing be? and what shall be the sign when all these
th shall be fulfilled?  13:5 and jesu answer them began to
say, take heed lest ani man deceiv you: 13:6 for mani shall come in
mi name, saying, I am christ; and shall deceiv many.

13:7 and when ye shall hear of war and rumour of wars, be ye not
troubled: for such thing must need be; but the end shall not be yet.

13:8 for nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against
kingdom: and there shall be earthquak in diver places, and there
shal be famin and troubles: these are the begin of sorrows.

13:9 but take heed to yourselves: for they shall deliv you up to
councils; and in the synagogu ye shall be beaten: and ye shall be
brought befor ruler and king for my sake, for a testimoni against
them.

13:10 and the gospel must first be publish among all nations.

13:11 but when they shall lead you, and deliv you up, take no
thought beforehand what ye shall speak, neither do ye premeditate: but
whatsoev shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye: for it is
not ye that speak, but the holi ghost.

13:12 now the brother shall betray the brother to death, and the
fath the son; and children shall rise up against their parents, and
shal caus them to be put to death.

13:13 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name' sake: but he that
shal endur unto the end, the same shall be saved.

13:14 but when ye shall see the abomin of desolation, spoken of
bi daniel the prophet, stand where it ought not, (let him that
readeth understand,) then let them that be in judaea flee to the
mountains: 13:15 and let him that is on the housetop not go down into
th house, neither enter therein, to take ani thing out of hi house:
13:16 and let him that is in the field not turn back again for to take
up hi garment.

13:17 but woe to them that are with child, and to them that give suck
in those days!  13:18 and pray ye that your flight be not in the
winter.

13:19 for in those day shall be affliction, such as wa not from the
begin of the creation which god creat unto thi time, neither
shal be.

13:20 and except that the lord had shorten those days, no flesh
should be saved: but for the elect' sake, whom he hath chosen, he
hath shorten the days.

13:21 and then if ani man shall say to you, lo, here is christ; or,
lo, he is there; believ him not: 13:22 for fals christ and false
prophet shall rise, and shall shew sign and wonders, to seduce, if
it were possible, even the elect.

13:23 but take ye heed: behold, I have foretold you all things.

13:24 but in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be
darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, 13:25 and the stars
of heaven shall fall, and the power that are in heaven shall be
shaken.

13:26 and then shall they see the son of man come in the cloud with
great power and glory.

13:27 and then shall he send hi angels, and shall gather togeth his
elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the
uttermost part of heaven.

13:28 now learn a parabl of the fig tree; when her branch is yet
tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is near: 13:29
so ye in like manner, when ye shall see these thing come to pass,
know that it is nigh, even at the doors.

13:30 verili I say unto you, that thi gener shall not pass, till
al these thing be done.

13:31 heaven and earth shall pass away: but my word shall not pass
away.

13:32 but of that day and that hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels
which are in heaven, neither the son, but the father.

13:33 take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.

13:34 for the son of man is as a man take a far journey, who left
hi house, and gave author to hi servants, and to everi man his
work, and command the porter to watch.

13:35 watch ye therefore: for ye know not when the master of the house
cometh, at even, or at midnight, or at the cockcrowing, or in the
morning: 13:36 lest come suddenli he find you sleeping.

13:37 and what I say unto you I say unto all, watch.

14:1 after two day wa the feast of the passover, and of unleavened
bread: and the chief priest and the scribe sought how they might
tak him by craft, and put him to death.

14:2 but they said, not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar of
th people.

14:3 and be in bethani in the hous of simon the leper, as he sat
at meat, there came a woman have an alabast box of ointment of
spikenard veri precious; and she brake the box, and pour it on his
head.

14:4 and there were some that had indign within themselves, and
said, whi wa thi wast of the ointment made?  14:5 for it might have
been sold for more than three hundr pence, and have been given to
th poor. and they murmur against her.

14:6 and jesu said, let her alone; whi troubl ye her? she hath
wrought a good work on me.

14:7 for ye have the poor with you always, and whensoev ye will ye
may do them good: but me ye have not always.

14:8 she hath done what she could: she is come aforehand to anoint my
bodi to the burying.

14:9 verili I say unto you, wheresoev thi gospel shall be preached
throughout the whole world, thi also that she hath done shall be
spoken of for a memori of her.

14:10 and juda iscariot, one of the twelve, went unto the chief
priests, to betray him unto them.

14:11 and when they heard it, they were glad, and promis to give him
money. and he sought how he might conveni betray him.

14:12 and the first day of unleaven bread, when they kill the
passover, hi discipl said unto him, where wilt thou that we go and
prepar that thou mayest eat the passover?  14:13 and he sendeth forth
two of hi disciples, and saith unto them, Go ye into the city, and
ther shall meet you a man bear a pitcher of water: follow him.

14:14 and wheresoev he shall go in, say ye to the goodman of the
house, the master saith, where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat
th passov with my disciples?  14:15 and he will shew you a large
upp room furnish and prepared: there make readi for us.

14:16 and hi discipl went forth, and came into the city, and found
a he had said unto them: and they made readi the passover.

14:17 and in the even he cometh with the twelve.

14:18 and as they sat and did eat, jesu said, verili I say unto you,
on of you which eateth with me shall betray me.

14:19 and they began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one,
i it I? and anoth said, Is it I?  14:20 and he answer and said
unto them, It is one of the twelve, that dippeth with me in the dish.

14:21 the son of man inde goeth, as it is written of him: but woe to
that man by whom the son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man
if he had never been born.

14:22 and as they did eat, jesu took bread, and blessed, and brake
it, and gave to them, and said, take, eat: thi is my body.

14:23 and he took the cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to
them: and they all drank of it.

14:24 and he said unto them, thi is my blood of the new testament,
which is shed for many.

14:25 verili I say unto you, I will drink no more of the fruit of the
vine, until that day that I drink it new in the kingdom of god.

14:26 and when they had sung an hymn, they went out into the mount of
olives.

14:27 and jesu saith unto them, all ye shall be offend becaus of
m thi night: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the
sheep shall be scattered.

14:28 but after that I am risen, I will go befor you into galilee.

14:29 but peter said unto him, although all shall be offended, yet
wil not i.

14:30 and jesu saith unto him, verili I say unto thee, that thi day,
even in thi night, befor the cock crow twice, thou shalt deni me
thrice.

14:31 but he spake the more vehemently, If I should die with thee, i
wil not deni thee in ani wise. likewis also said they all.

14:32 and they came to a place which wa name gethsemane: and he
saith to hi disciples, sit ye here, while I shall pray.

14:33 and he taketh with him peter and jame and john, and began to be
sor amazed, and to be veri heavy; 14:34 and saith unto them, My soul
i exceed sorrow unto death: tarri ye here, and watch.

14:35 and he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed
that, if it were possible, the hour might pass from him.

14:36 and he said, abba, father, all thing are possibl unto thee;
tak away thi cup from me: nevertheless not what I will, but what
thou wilt.

14:37 and he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto peter,
simon, sleepest thou? couldest not thou watch one hour?  14:38 watch
y and pray, lest ye enter into temptation. the spirit truli is ready,
but the flesh is weak.

14:39 and again he went away, and prayed, and spake the same words.

14:40 and when he returned, he found them asleep again, (for their
ey were heavy,) neither wist they what to answer him.

14:41 and he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, sleep on now,
and take your rest: it is enough, the hour is come; behold, the son of
man is betray into the hand of sinners.

14:42 rise up, let us go; lo, he that betrayeth me is at hand.

14:43 and immediately, while he yet spake, cometh judas, one of the
twelve, and with him a great multitud with sword and staves, from
th chief priest and the scribe and the elders.

14:44 and he that betray him had given them a token, saying,
whomsoev I shall kiss, that same is he; take him, and lead him away
safely.

14:45 and as soon as he wa come, he goeth straightway to him, and
saith, master, master; and kiss him.

14:46 and they laid their hand on him, and took him.

14:47 and one of them that stood by drew a sword, and smote a servant
of the high priest, and cut off hi ear.

14:48 and jesu answer and said unto them, are ye come out, as
against a thief, with sword and with stave to take me?  14:49 I was
daili with you in the templ teaching, and ye took me not: but the
scriptur must be fulfilled.

14:50 and they all forsook him, and fled.

14:51 and there follow him a certain young man, have a linen cloth
cast about hi nake body; and the young men laid hold on him: 14:52
and he left the linen cloth, and fled from them naked.

14:53 and they led jesu away to the high priest: and with him were
assembl all the chief priest and the elder and the scribes.

14:54 and peter follow him afar off, even into the palac of the
high priest: and he sat with the servants, and warm himself at the
fire.

14:55 and the chief priest and all the council sought for witness
against jesu to put him to death; and found none.

14:56 for mani bare fals wit against him, but their witness
agre not together.

14:57 and there aros certain, and bare fals wit against him,
saying, 14:58 We heard him say, I will destroy thi templ that is
mad with hands, and within three day I will build anoth made
without hands.

14:59 but neither so did their wit agre together.

14:60 and the high priest stood up in the midst, and ask jesus,
saying, answerest thou nothing? what is it which these wit against
thee?  14:61 but he held hi peace, and answer nothing. again the
high priest ask him, and said unto him, art thou the christ, the son
of the blessed?  14:62 and jesu said, I am: and ye shall see the son
of man sit on the right hand of power, and come in the cloud of
heaven.

14:63 then the high priest rent hi clothes, and saith, what need we
ani further witnesses?  14:64 Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think
ye? and they all condemn him to be guilti of death.

14:65 and some began to spit on him, and to cover hi face, and to
buffet him, and to say unto him, prophesy: and the servant did strike
him with the palm of their hands.

14:66 and as peter wa beneath in the palace, there cometh one of the
maid of the high priest: 14:67 and when she saw peter warming
himself, she look upon him, and said, and thou also wast with jesus
of nazareth.

14:68 but he denied, saying, I know not, neither understand I what
thou sayest. and he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.

14:69 and a maid saw him again, and began to say to them that stood
by, thi is one of them.

14:70 and he deni it again. and a littl after, they that stood by
said again to peter, sure thou art one of them: for thou art a
galilaean, and thi speech agreeth thereto.

14:71 but he began to curs and to swear, saying, I know not thi man
of whom ye speak.

14:72 and the second time the cock crew. and peter call to mind the
word that jesu said unto him, befor the cock crow twice, thou shalt
deni me thrice. and when he thought thereon, he wept.

15:1 and straightway in the morn the chief priest held a
consult with the elder and scribe and the whole council, and
bound jesus, and carri him away, and deliv him to pilate.

15:2 and pilat ask him, art thou the king of the jews? and he
answ said unto them, thou sayest it.

15:3 and the chief priest accus him of mani things: but he answered
nothing.

15:4 and pilat ask him again, saying, answerest thou nothing?
behold how mani thing they wit against thee.

15:5 but jesu yet answer nothing; so that pilat marvelled.

15:6 now at that feast he releas unto them one prisoner, whomsoever
they desired.

15:7 and there wa one name barabbas, which lay bound with them that
had made insurrect with him, who had commit murder in the
insurrection.

15:8 and the multitud cri aloud began to desir him to do as he
had ever done unto them.

15:9 but pilat answer them, saying, will ye that I releas unto you
th king of the jews?  15:10 for he knew that the chief priest had
deliv him for envy.

15:11 but the chief priest move the people, that he should rather
releas barabba unto them.

15:12 and pilat answer and said again unto them, what will ye then
that I shall do unto him whom ye call the king of the jews?  15:13 and
they cri out again, crucifi him.

15:14 then pilat said unto them, why, what evil hath he done? and
they cri out the more exceedingly, crucifi him.

15:15 and so pilate, will to content the people, releas barabbas
unto them, and deliv jesus, when he had scourg him, to be
crucified.

15:16 and the soldier led him away into the hall, call praetorium;
and they call togeth the whole band.

15:17 and they cloth him with purple, and plat a crown of thorns,
and put it about hi head, 15:18 and began to salut him, hail, king
of the jews!  15:19 and they smote him on the head with a reed, and
did spit upon him, and bow their knee worship him.

15:20 and when they had mock him, they took off the purpl from him,
and put hi own cloth on him, and led him out to crucifi him.

15:21 and they compel one simon a cyrenian, who pass by, come out
of the country, the father of alexand and rufus, to bear hi cross.

15:22 and they bring him unto the place golgotha, which is, being
interpreted, the place of a skull.

15:23 and they gave him to drink wine mingl with myrrh: but he
receiv it not.

15:24 and when they had crucifi him, they part hi garments,
cast lot upon them, what everi man should take.

15:25 and it wa the third hour, and they crucifi him.

15:26 and the superscript of hi accus wa written over, the
k OF the jews.

15:27 and with him they crucifi two thieves; the one on hi right
hand, and the other on hi left.

15:28 and the scriptur wa fulfilled, which saith, and he was
numb with the transgressors.

15:29 and they that pass by rail on him, wag their heads, and
saying, ah, thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three
days, 15:30 save thyself, and come down from the cross.

15:31 likewis also the chief priest mock said among themselves
with the scribes, He save others; himself he cannot save.

15:32 let christ the king of israel descend now from the cross, that
w may see and believe. and they that were crucifi with him reviled
him.

15:33 and when the sixth hour wa come, there wa dark over the
whol land until the ninth hour.

15:34 and at the ninth hour jesu cri with a loud voice, saying,
eloi, eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, be interpreted, My god, my
god, whi hast thou forsaken me?  15:35 and some of them that stood by,
when they heard it, said, behold, he calleth elias.

15:36 and one ran and fill a spung full of vinegar, and put it on a
reed, and gave him to drink, saying, let alone; let us see whether
elia will come to take him down.

15:37 and jesu cri with a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

15:38 and the veil of the templ wa rent in twain from the top to the
bottom.

15:39 and when the centurion, which stood over against him, saw that
h so cri out, and gave up the ghost, he said, truli thi man was
th son of god.

15:40 there were also women look on afar off: among whom wa mary
magdalene, and mari the mother of jame the less and of joses, and
salome; 15:41 (who also, when he wa in galilee, follow him, and
minist unto him;) and mani other women which came up with him unto
jerusalem.

15:42 and now when the even wa come, becaus it wa the preparation,
that is, the day befor the sabbath, 15:43 joseph of arimathaea, an
honour counsellor, which also wait for the kingdom of god, came,
and went in boldli unto pilate, and crave the bodi of jesus.

15:44 and pilat marvel if he were alreadi dead: and call unto
him the centurion, he ask him whether he had been ani while dead.

15:45 and when he knew it of the centurion, he gave the bodi to
joseph.

15:46 and he bought fine linen, and took him down, and wrap him in
th linen, and laid him in a sepulchr which wa hewn out of a rock,
and roll a stone unto the door of the sepulchre.

15:47 and mari magdalen and mari the mother of jose beheld where he
wa laid.

16:1 and when the sabbath wa past, mari magdalene, and mari the
moth of james, and salome, had bought sweet spices, that they might
com and anoint him.

16:2 and veri earli in the morn the first day of the week, they
cam unto the sepulchr at the rise of the sun.

16:3 and they said among themselves, who shall roll us away the stone
from the door of the sepulchre?  16:4 and when they looked, they saw
that the stone wa roll away: for it wa veri great.

16:5 and enter into the sepulchre, they saw a young man sit on
th right side, cloth in a long white garment; and they were
affrighted.

16:6 and he saith unto them, Be not affrighted: Ye seek jesu of
nazareth, which wa crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold the
plac where they laid him.

16:7 but go your way, tell hi discipl and peter that he goeth
befor you into galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.

16:8 and they went out quickly, and fled from the sepulchre; for they
trembl and were amazed: neither said they ani thing to ani man; for
they were afraid.

16:9 now when jesu wa risen earli the first day of the week, he
appear first to mari magdalene, out of whom he had cast seven
devils.

16:10 and she went and told them that had been with him, as they
mourn and wept.

16:11 and they, when they had heard that he wa alive, and had been
seen of her, believ not.

16:12 after that he appear in anoth form unto two of them, as they
walked, and went into the country.

16:13 and they went and told it unto the residue: neither believed
they them.

16:14 afterward he appear unto the eleven as they sat at meat, and
upbraid them with their unbelief and hard of heart, becaus they
believ not them which had seen him after he wa risen.

16:15 and he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the
gospel to everi creature.

16:16 He that believeth and is baptiz shall be saved; but he that
believeth not shall be damned.

16:17 and these sign shall follow them that believe; In my name shall
they cast out devils; they shall speak with new tongues; 16:18 they
shal take up serpents; and if they drink ani deadli thing, it shall
not hurt them; they shall lay hand on the sick, and they shall
recover.

16:19 So then after the lord had spoken unto them, he wa receiv up
into heaven, and sat on the right hand of god.

16:20 and they went forth, and preach everi where, the lord working
with them, and confirm the word with sign following. amen.




th gospel accord to saint luke


1:1 forasmuch as mani have taken in hand to set forth in order a
declar of those thing which are most sure believ among us,
1:2 even as they deliv them unto us, which from the begin were
eyewitnesses, and minist of the word; 1:3 It seem good to me
also, have had perfect understand of all thing from the very
first, to write unto thee in order, most excel theophilus, 1:4
that thou mightest know the certainti of those things, wherein thou
hast been instructed.

1:5 there wa in the day of herod, the king of judaea, a certain
priest name zacharias, of the cours of abia: and hi wife wa of the
daught of aaron, and her name wa elisabeth.

1:6 and they were both righteou befor god, walk in all the
command and ordin of the lord blameless.

1:7 and they had no child, becaus that elisabeth wa barren, and they
both were now well stricken in years.

1:8 and it came to pass, that while he execut the priest' office
befor god in the order of hi course, 1:9 accord to the custom of
th priest' office, hi lot wa to burn incens when he went into the
templ of the lord.

1:10 and the whole multitud of the peopl were pray without at the
tim of incense.

1:11 and there appear unto him an angel of the lord stand on the
right side of the altar of incense.

1:12 and when zacharia saw him, he wa troubled, and fear fell upon
him.

1:13 but the angel said unto him, fear not, zacharias: for thi prayer
i heard; and thi wife elisabeth shall bear thee a son, and thou shalt
cal hi name john.

1:14 and thou shalt have joy and gladness; and mani shall rejoic at
hi birth.

1:15 for he shall be great in the sight of the lord, and shall drink
neith wine nor strong drink; and he shall be fill with the holy
ghost, even from hi mother' womb.

1:16 and mani of the children of israel shall he turn to the lord
their god.

1:17 and he shall go befor him in the spirit and power of elias, to
turn the heart of the father to the children, and the disobedi to
th wisdom of the just; to make readi a peopl prepar for the lord.

1:18 and zacharia said unto the angel, wherebi shall I know this? for
i am an old man, and my wife well stricken in years.

1:19 and the angel answer said unto him, I am gabriel, that stand
in the presenc of god; and am sent to speak unto thee, and to shew
the these glad tidings.

1:20 and, behold, thou shalt be dumb, and not abl to speak, until the
day that these thing shall be performed, becaus thou believest not
mi words, which shall be fulfil in their season.

1:21 and the peopl wait for zacharias, and marvel that he
tarri so long in the temple.

1:22 and when he came out, he could not speak unto them: and they
perceiv that he had seen a vision in the temple: for he beckoned
unto them, and remain speechless.
