1:23 and it came to pass, that, as soon as the day of his
ministr were accomplished, he depart to hi own house.

1:24 and after those day hi wife elisabeth conceived, and hid
herself five months, saying, 1:25 thu hath the lord dealt with me in
th day wherein he look on me, to take away my reproach among men.

1:26 and in the sixth month the angel gabriel wa sent from god unto a
citi of galilee, name nazareth, 1:27 To a virgin espous to a man
whos name wa joseph, of the hous of david; and the virgin' name
wa mary.

1:28 and the angel came in unto her, and said, hail, thou that art
highli favoured, the lord is with thee: bless art thou among women.

1:29 and when she saw him, she wa troubl at hi saying, and cast in
her mind what manner of salut thi should be.

1:30 and the angel said unto her, fear not, mary: for thou hast found
favour with god.

1:31 and, behold, thou shalt conceiv in thi womb, and bring forth a
son, and shalt call hi name jesus.

1:32 He shall be great, and shall be call the son of the highest:
and the lord god shall give unto him the throne of hi father david:
1:33 and he shall reign over the hous of jacob for ever; and of his
kingdom there shall be no end.

1:34 then said mari unto the angel, how shall thi be, see I know
not a man?  1:35 and the angel answer and said unto her, the holy
ghost shall come upon thee, and the power of the highest shall
overshadow thee: therefor also that holi thing which shall be born of
the shall be call the son of god.

1:36 and, behold, thi cousin elisabeth, she hath also conceiv a son
in her old age: and thi is the sixth month with her, who wa called
barren.

1:37 for with god noth shall be impossible.

1:38 and mari said, behold the handmaid of the lord; be it unto me
accord to thi word. and the angel depart from her.

1:39 and mari aros in those days, and went into the hill countri with
haste, into a citi of juda; 1:40 and enter into the hous of
zacharias, and salut elisabeth.

1:41 and it came to pass, that, when elisabeth heard the salut of
mary, the babe leap in her womb; and elisabeth wa fill with the
holi ghost: 1:42 and she spake out with a loud voice, and said,
bless art thou among women, and bless is the fruit of thi womb.

1:43 and whenc is thi to me, that the mother of my lord should come
to me?  1:44 for, lo, as soon as the voic of thi salut sounded
in mine ears, the babe leap in my womb for joy.

1:45 and bless is she that believed: for there shall be a
perform of those thing which were told her from the lord.

1:46 and mari said, My soul doth magnifi the lord, 1:47 and my spirit
hath rejoic in god my saviour.

1:48 for he hath regard the low estat of hi handmaiden: for,
behold, from henceforth all gener shall call me blessed.

1:49 for he that is mighti hath done to me great things; and holi is
hi name.

1:50 and hi merci is on them that fear him from gener to
generation.

1:51 He hath shew strength with hi arm; he hath scatter the proud
in the imagin of their hearts.

1:52 He hath put down the mighti from their seats, and exalt them of
low degree.

1:53 He hath fill the hungri with good things; and the rich he hath
sent empti away.

1:54 He hath holpen hi servant israel, in remembr of hi mercy;
1:55 As he spake to our fathers, to abraham, and to hi seed for ever.

1:56 and mari abod with her about three months, and return to her
own house.

1:57 now elisabeth' full time came that she should be delivered; and
sh brought forth a son.

1:58 and her neighbour and her cousin heard how the lord had shewed
great merci upon her; and they rejoic with her.

1:59 and it came to pass, that on the eighth day they came to
circumcis the child; and they call him zacharias, after the name of
hi father.

1:60 and hi mother answer and said, not so; but he shall be called
john.

1:61 and they said unto her, there is none of thi kindr that is
cal by thi name.

1:62 and they made sign to hi father, how he would have him called.

1:63 and he ask for a write table, and wrote, saying, hi name is
john. and they marvel all.

1:64 and hi mouth wa open immediately, and hi tongu loosed, and
h spake, and prais god.

1:65 and fear came on all that dwelt round about them: and all these
say were nois abroad throughout all the hill countri of judaea.

1:66 and all they that heard them laid them up in their hearts,
saying, what manner of child shall thi be! and the hand of the lord
wa with him.

1:67 and hi father zacharia wa fill with the holi ghost, and
prophesied, saying, 1:68 bless be the lord god of israel; for he
hath visit and redeem hi people, 1:69 and hath rais up an horn
of salvat for us in the hous of hi servant david; 1:70 As he
spak by the mouth of hi holi prophets, which have been sinc the
world began: 1:71 that we should be save from our enemies, and from
th hand of all that hate us; 1:72 To perform the merci promis to
our fathers, and to rememb hi holi covenant; 1:73 the oath which he
swar to our father abraham, 1:74 that he would grant unto us, that we
b deliv out of the hand of our enemi might serv him without
fear, 1:75 In holi and righteous befor him, all the day of
our life.

1:76 and thou, child, shalt be call the prophet of the highest: for
thou shalt go befor the face of the lord to prepar hi ways; 1:77 to
giv knowledg of salvat unto hi peopl by the remiss of their
sins, 1:78 through the tender merci of our god; wherebi the dayspring
from on high hath visit us, 1:79 To give light to them that sit in
dark and in the shadow of death, to guid our feet into the way of
peace.

1:80 and the child grew, and wax strong in spirit, and wa in the
desert till the day of hi shew unto israel.

2:1 and it came to pass in those days, that there went out a decree
from caesar augustu that all the world should be taxed.

2:2 (and thi tax wa first made when cyreniu wa governor of
syria.)  2:3 and all went to be taxed, everi one into hi own city.

2:4 and joseph also went up from galilee, out of the citi of nazareth,
into judaea, unto the citi of david, which is call bethlehem;
(becaus he wa of the hous and lineag of david:) 2:5 To be taxed
with mari hi espous wife, be great with child.

2:6 and so it was, that, while they were there, the day were
accomplish that she should be delivered.

2:7 and she brought forth her firstborn son, and wrap him in
swaddl clothes, and laid him in a manger; becaus there wa no room
for them in the inn.

2:8 and there were in the same countri shepherd abid in the field,
keep watch over their flock by night.

2:9 and, lo, the angel of the lord came upon them, and the glori of
th lord shone round about them: and they were sore afraid.

2:10 and the angel said unto them, fear not: for, behold, I bring you
good tide of great joy, which shall be to all people.

2:11 for unto you is born thi day in the citi of david a saviour,
which is christ the lord.

2:12 and thi shall be a sign unto you; Ye shall find the babe wrapped
in swaddl clothes, lie in a manger.

2:13 and suddenli there wa with the angel a multitud of the heavenly
host prais god, and saying, 2:14 glori to god in the highest, and
on earth peace, good will toward men.

2:15 and it came to pass, as the angel were gone away from them into
heaven, the shepherd said one to another, let us now go even unto
bethlehem, and see thi thing which is come to pass, which the lord
hath made known unto us.

2:16 and they came with haste, and found mary, and joseph, and the
bab lie in a manger.

2:17 and when they had seen it, they made known abroad the saying
which wa told them concern thi child.

2:18 and all they that heard it wonder at those thing which were
told them by the shepherds.

2:19 but mari kept all these things, and ponder them in her heart.

2:20 and the shepherd returned, glorifi and prais god for all
th thing that they had heard and seen, as it wa told unto them.

2:21 and when eight day were accomplish for the circumcis of the
child, hi name wa call jesus, which wa so name of the angel
befor he wa conceiv in the womb.

2:22 and when the day of her purif accord to the law of
mos were accomplished, they brought him to jerusalem, to present him
to the lord; 2:23 (a it is written in the law of the lord, everi male
that openeth the womb shall be call holi to the lord;) 2:24 and to
off a sacrific accord to that which is said in the law of the
lord, A pair of turtledoves, or two young pigeons.

2:25 and, behold, there wa a man in jerusalem, whose name wa simeon;
and the same man wa just and devout, wait for the consol of
israel: and the holi ghost wa upon him.

2:26 and it wa reveal unto him by the holi ghost, that he should
not see death, befor he had seen the lord' christ.

2:27 and he came by the spirit into the temple: and when the parents
brought in the child jesus, to do for him after the custom of the law,
2:28 then took he him up in hi arms, and bless god, and said, 2:29
lord, now lettest thou thi servant depart in peace, accord to thy
word: 2:30 for mine eye have seen thi salvation, 2:31 which thou hast
prepar befor the face of all people; 2:32 A light to lighten the
gentiles, and the glori of thi peopl israel.

2:33 and joseph and hi mother marvel at those thing which were
spoken of him.

2:34 and simeon bless them, and said unto mari hi mother, behold,
thi child is set for the fall and rise again of mani in israel; and
for a sign which shall be spoken against; 2:35 (yea, a sword shall
pierc through thi own soul also,) that the thought of mani hearts
may be revealed.

2:36 and there wa one anna, a prophetess, the daughter of phanuel, of
th tribe of aser: she wa of a great age, and had live with an
husband seven year from her virginity; 2:37 and she wa a widow of
about fourscor and four years, which depart not from the temple,
but serv god with fast and prayer night and day.

2:38 and she come in that instant gave thank likewis unto the
lord, and spake of him to all them that look for redempt in
jerusalem.

2:39 and when they had perform all thing accord to the law of
th lord, they return into galilee, to their own citi nazareth.

2:40 and the child grew, and wax strong in spirit, fill with
wisdom: and the grace of god wa upon him.

2:41 now hi parent went to jerusalem everi year at the feast of the
passover.

2:42 and when he wa twelv year old, they went up to jerusalem after
th custom of the feast.

2:43 and when they had fulfil the days, as they returned, the child
jesu tarri behind in jerusalem; and joseph and hi mother knew not
of it.

2:44 but they, suppos him to have been in the company, went a day's
journey; and they sought him among their kinsfolk and acquaintance.

2:45 and when they found him not, they turn back again to jerusalem,
seek him.

2:46 and it came to pass, that after three day they found him in the
temple, sit in the midst of the doctors, both hear them, and
ask them questions.

2:47 and all that heard him were astonish at hi understand and
answers.

2:48 and when they saw him, they were amazed: and hi mother said unto
him, son, whi hast thou thu dealt with us? behold, thi father and i
hav sought thee sorrowing.

2:49 and he said unto them, how is it that ye sought me? wist ye not
that I must be about my father' business?  2:50 and they understood
not the say which he spake unto them.

2:51 and he went down with them, and came to nazareth, and wa subject
unto them: but hi mother kept all these say in her heart.

2:52 and jesu increas in wisdom and stature, and in favour with god
and man.

3:1 now in the fifteenth year of the reign of tiberiu caesar, pontius
pil be governor of judaea, and herod be tetrarch of galilee,
and hi brother philip tetrarch of ituraea and of the region of
trachonitis, and lysania the tetrarch of abilene, 3:2 anna and
caiapha be the high priests, the word of god came unto john the
son of zacharia in the wilderness.

3:3 and he came into all the countri about jordan, preach the
bapt of repent for the remiss of sins; 3:4 As it is written
in the book of the word of esaia the prophet, saying, the voic of
on cri in the wilderness, prepar ye the way of the lord, make his
path straight.

3:5 everi valley shall be filled, and everi mountain and hill shall be
brought low; and the crook shall be made straight, and the rough
way shall be made smooth; 3:6 and all flesh shall see the salvation
of god.

3:7 then said he to the multitud that came forth to be baptiz of
him, O gener of vipers, who hath warn you to flee from the
wrath to come?  3:8 bring forth therefor fruit worthi of repentance,
and begin not to say within yourselves, We have abraham to our father:
for I say unto you, that god is abl of these stone to rais up
children unto abraham.

3:9 and now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every
tre therefor which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and
cast into the fire.

3:10 and the peopl ask him, saying, what shall we do then?  3:11 he
answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart
to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.

3:12 then came also publican to be baptized, and said unto him,
master, what shall we do?  3:13 and he said unto them, exact no more
than that which is appoint you.

3:14 and the soldier likewis demand of him, saying, and what shall
w do? and he said unto them, Do violenc to no man, neither accuse
ani falsely; and be content with your wages.

3:15 and as the peopl were in expectation, and all men muse in their
heart of john, whether he were the christ, or not; 3:16 john
answered, say unto them all, I inde baptiz you with water; but
on mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoe I am not worthy
to unloose: he shall baptiz you with the holi ghost and with fire:
3:17 whose fan is in hi hand, and he will throughli purg hi floor,
and will gather the wheat into hi garner; but the chaff he will burn
with fire unquenchable.

3:18 and mani other thing in hi exhort preach he unto the
people.

3:19 but herod the tetrarch, be reprov by him for herodia his
broth philip' wife, and for all the evil which herod had done,
3:20 ad yet thi abov all, that he shut up john in prison.

3:21 now when all the peopl were baptized, it came to pass, that
jesu also be baptized, and praying, the heaven wa opened, 3:22
and the holi ghost descend in a bodili shape like a dove upon him,
and a voic came from heaven, which said, thou art my belov son; in
the I am well pleased.

3:23 and jesu himself began to be about thirti year of age, being
(a wa supposed) the son of joseph, which wa the son of heli, 3:24
which wa the son of matthat, which wa the son of levi, which wa the
son of melchi, which wa the son of janna, which wa the son of
joseph, 3:25 which wa the son of mattathias, which wa the son of
amos, which wa the son of naum, which wa the son of esli, which was
th son of nagge, 3:26 which wa the son of maath, which wa the son
of mattathias, which wa the son of semei, which wa the son of
joseph, which wa the son of juda, 3:27 which wa the son of joanna,
which wa the son of rhesa, which wa the son of zorobabel, which was
th son of salathiel, which wa the son of neri, 3:28 which wa the
son of melchi, which wa the son of addi, which wa the son of cosam,
which wa the son of elmodam, which wa the son of er, 3:29 which was
th son of jose, which wa the son of eliezer, which wa the son of
jorim, which wa the son of matthat, which wa the son of levi, 3:30
which wa the son of simeon, which wa the son of juda, which wa the
son of joseph, which wa the son of jonan, which wa the son of
eliakim, 3:31 which wa the son of melea, which wa the son of menan,
which wa the son of mattatha, which wa the son of nathan, which was
th son of david, 3:32 which wa the son of jesse, which wa the son
of obed, which wa the son of booz, which wa the son of salmon, which
wa the son of naasson, 3:33 which wa the son of aminadab, which was
th son of aram, which wa the son of esrom, which wa the son of
phares, which wa the son of juda, 3:34 which wa the son of jacob,
which wa the son of isaac, which wa the son of abraham, which was
th son of thara, which wa the son of nachor, 3:35 which wa the son
of saruch, which wa the son of ragau, which wa the son of phalec,
which wa the son of heber, which wa the son of sala, 3:36 which was
th son of cainan, which wa the son of arphaxad, which wa the son of
sem, which wa the son of noe, which wa the son of lamech, 3:37 which
wa the son of mathusala, which wa the son of enoch, which wa the
son of jared, which wa the son of maleleel, which wa the son of
cainan, 3:38 which wa the son of enos, which wa the son of seth,
which wa the son of adam, which wa the son of god.

4:1 and jesu be full of the holi ghost return from jordan, and
wa led by the spirit into the wilderness, 4:2 be forti days
tempt of the devil. and in those day he did eat nothing: and when
they were ended, he afterward hungered.

4:3 and the devil said unto him, If thou be the son of god, command
thi stone that it be made bread.

4:4 and jesu answer him, saying, It is written, that man shall not
liv by bread alone, but by everi word of god.

4:5 and the devil, take him up into an high mountain, shew unto
him all the kingdom of the world in a moment of time.

4:6 and the devil said unto him, all thi power will I give thee, and
th glori of them: for that is deliv unto me; and to whomsoev i
wil I give it.

4:7 If thou therefor wilt worship me, all shall be thine.

4:8 and jesu answer and said unto him, get thee behind me, satan:
for it is written, thou shalt worship the lord thi god, and him only
shalt thou serve.

4:9 and he brought him to jerusalem, and set him on a pinnacl of the
temple, and said unto him, If thou be the son of god, cast thyself
down from hence: 4:10 for it is written, He shall give hi angels
charg over thee, to keep thee: 4:11 and in their hand they shall
bear thee up, lest at ani time thou dash thi foot against a stone.

4:12 and jesu answer said unto him, It is said, thou shalt not
tempt the lord thi god.

4:13 and when the devil had end all the temptation, he depart from
him for a season.

4:14 and jesu return in the power of the spirit into galilee: and
ther went out a fame of him through all the region round about.

4:15 and he taught in their synagogues, be glorifi of all.

4:16 and he came to nazareth, where he had been brought up: and, as
hi custom was, he went into the synagogu on the sabbath day, and
stood up for to read.

4:17 and there wa deliv unto him the book of the prophet esaias.
and when he had open the book, he found the place where it was
written, 4:18 the spirit of the lord is upon me, becaus he hath
anoint me to preach the gospel to the poor; he hath sent me to heal
th brokenhearted, to preach deliver to the captives, and
recov of sight to the blind, to set at liberti them that are
bruised, 4:19 To preach the accept year of the lord.

4:20 and he close the book, and he gave it again to the minister, and
sat down. and the eye of all them that were in the synagogu were
fasten on him.

4:21 and he began to say unto them, thi day is thi scripture
fulfil in your ears.

4:22 and all bare him witness, and wonder at the graciou words
which proceed out of hi mouth. and they said, Is not thi joseph's
son?  4:23 and he said unto them, Ye will sure say unto me this
proverb, physician, heal thyself: whatsoev we have heard done in
capernaum, do also here in thi country.

4:24 and he said, verili I say unto you, No prophet is accept in his
own country.

4:25 but I tell you of a truth, mani widow were in israel in the days
of elias, when the heaven wa shut up three year and six months, when
great famin wa throughout all the land; 4:26 but unto none of them
wa elia sent, save unto sarepta, a citi of sidon, unto a woman that
wa a widow.

4:27 and mani leper were in israel in the time of eliseu the
prophet; and none of them wa cleansed, save naaman the syrian.

4:28 and all they in the synagogue, when they heard these things, were
fil with wrath, 4:29 and rose up, and thrust him out of the city,
and led him unto the brow of the hill whereon their citi wa built,
that they might cast him down headlong.

4:30 but he pass through the midst of them went hi way, 4:31 and
cam down to capernaum, a citi of galilee, and taught them on the
sabbath days.

4:32 and they were astonish at hi doctrine: for hi word wa with
power.

4:33 and in the synagogu there wa a man, which had a spirit of an
unclean devil, and cri out with a loud voice, 4:34 saying, let us
alone; what have we to do with thee, thou jesu of nazareth? art thou
com to destroy us? I know thee who thou art; the holi one of god.

4:35 and jesu rebuk him, saying, hold thi peace, and come out of
him.

and when the devil had thrown him in the midst, he came out of him,
and hurt him not.

4:36 and they were all amazed, and spake among themselves, saying,
what a word is this! for with author and power he commandeth the
unclean spirits, and they come out.

4:37 and the fame of him went out into everi place of the country
round about.

4:38 and he aros out of the synagogue, and enter into simon's
house.

and simon' wife' mother wa taken with a great fever; and they
besought him for her.

4:39 and he stood over her, and rebuk the fever; and it left her:
and immedi she aros and minist unto them.

4:40 now when the sun wa setting, all they that had ani sick with
div diseas brought them unto him; and he laid hi hand on every
on of them, and heal them.

4:41 and devil also came out of many, cri out, and saying, thou
art christ the son of god. and he rebuk them suffer them not to
speak: for they knew that he wa christ.

4:42 and when it wa day, he depart and went into a desert place:
and the peopl sought him, and came unto him, and stay him, that he
should not depart from them.

4:43 and he said unto them, I must preach the kingdom of god to other
c also: for therefor am I sent.

4:44 and he preach in the synagogu of galilee.

5:1 and it came to pass, that, as the peopl press upon him to hear
th word of god, he stood by the lake of gennesaret, 5:2 and saw two
ship stand by the lake: but the fishermen were gone out of them,
and were wash their nets.

5:3 and he enter into one of the ships, which wa simon's, and
pray him that he would thrust out a littl from the land. and he sat
down, and taught the peopl out of the ship.

5:4 now when he had left speaking, he said unto simon, launch out into
th deep, and let down your net for a draught.

5:5 and simon answer said unto him, master, we have toil all the
night, and have taken nothing: nevertheless at thi word I will let
down the net.

5:6 and when they had thi done, they inclos a great multitud of
fishes: and their net brake.

5:7 and they beckon unto their partners, which were in the other
ship, that they should come and help them. and they came, and filled
both the ships, so that they began to sink.

5:8 when simon peter saw it, he fell down at jesus' knees, saying,
depart from me; for I am a sin man, O lord.

5:9 for he wa astonished, and all that were with him, at the draught
of the fish which they had taken: 5:10 and so wa also james, and
john, the son of zebedee, which were partner with simon. and jesus
said unto simon, fear not; from henceforth thou shalt catch men.

5:11 and when they had brought their ship to land, they forsook all,
and follow him.

5:12 and it came to pass, when he wa in a certain city, behold a man
ful of leprosy: who see jesu fell on hi face, and besought him,
saying, lord, if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.

5:13 and he put forth hi hand, and touch him, saying, I will: be
thou clean. and immedi the leprosi depart from him.

5:14 and he charg him to tell no man: but go, and shew thyself to
th priest, and offer for thi cleansing, accord as mose commanded,
for a testimoni unto them.

5:15 but so much the more went there a fame abroad of him: and great
multitud came togeth to hear, and to be heal by him of their
infirmities.

5:16 and he withdrew himself into the wilderness, and prayed.

5:17 and it came to pass on a certain day, as he wa teaching, that
ther were pharise and doctor of the law sit by, which were
com out of everi town of galilee, and judaea, and jerusalem: and the
pow of the lord wa present to heal them.

5:18 and, behold, men brought in a bed a man which wa taken with a
palsy: and they sought mean to bring him in, and to lay him before
him.

5:19 and when they could not find by what way they might bring him in
becaus of the multitude, they went upon the housetop, and let him
down through the tile with hi couch into the midst befor jesus.

5:20 and when he saw their faith, he said unto him, man, thi sin are
forgiven thee.

5:21 and the scribe and the pharise began to reason, saying, who is
thi which speaketh blasphemies? who can forgiv sins, but god alone?
5:22 but when jesu perceiv their thoughts, he answer said unto
them, what reason ye in your hearts?  5:23 whether is easier, to say,
thi sin be forgiven thee; or to say, rise up and walk?  5:24 but that
y may know that the son of man hath power upon earth to forgiv sins,
(h said unto the sick of the palsy,) I say unto thee, arise, and take
up thi couch, and go into thine house.

5:25 and immedi he rose up befor them, and took up that whereon
h lay, and depart to hi own house, glorifi god.

5:26 and they were all amazed, and they glorifi god, and were filled
with fear, saying, We have seen strang thing to day.

5:27 and after these thing he went forth, and saw a publican, named
levi, sit at the receipt of custom: and he said unto him, follow
me.

5:28 and he left all, rose up, and follow him.

5:29 and levi made him a great feast in hi own house: and there wa a
great compani of publican and of other that sat down with them.

5:30 but their scribe and pharise murmur against hi disciples,
saying, whi do ye eat and drink with publican and sinners?  5:31 and
jesu answer said unto them, they that are whole need not a
physician; but they that are sick.

5:32 I came not to call the righteous, but sinner to repentance.

5:33 and they said unto him, whi do the discipl of john fast often,
and make prayers, and likewis the discipl of the pharisees; but
thin eat and drink?  5:34 and he said unto them, can ye make the
children of the bridechamb fast, while the bridegroom is with them?
5:35 but the day will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away
from them, and then shall they fast in those days.

5:36 and he spake also a parabl unto them; No man putteth a piec of
a new garment upon an old; if otherwise, then both the new maketh a
rent, and the piec that wa taken out of the new agreeth not with the
old.

5:37 and no man putteth new wine into old bottles; els the new wine
wil burst the bottles, and be spilled, and the bottl shall perish.

5:38 but new wine must be put into new bottles; and both are
preserved.

5:39 No man also have drunk old wine straightway desireth new: for
h saith, the old is better.

6:1 and it came to pass on the second sabbath after the first, that he
went through the corn fields; and hi discipl pluck the ear of
corn, and did eat, rub them in their hands.

6:2 and certain of the pharise said unto them, whi do ye that which
i not law to do on the sabbath days?  6:3 and jesu answer them
said, have ye not read so much as this, what david did, when himself
wa an hungred, and they which were with him; 6:4 how he went into the
hous of god, and did take and eat the shewbread, and gave also to
them that were with him; which it is not law to eat but for the
priest alone?  6:5 and he said unto them, that the son of man is lord
also of the sabbath.

6:6 and it came to pass also on anoth sabbath, that he enter into
th synagogu and taught: and there wa a man whose right hand was
withered.

6:7 and the scribe and pharise watch him, whether he would heal
on the sabbath day; that they might find an accus against him.

6:8 but he knew their thoughts, and said to the man which had the
with hand, rise up, and stand forth in the midst. and he aros and
stood forth.

6:9 then said jesu unto them, I will ask you one thing; Is it lawful
on the sabbath day to do good, or to do evil? to save life, or to
destroy it?  6:10 and look round about upon them all, he said unto
th man, stretch forth thi hand. and he did so: and hi hand was
restor whole as the other.

6:11 and they were fill with madness; and commun one with another
what they might do to jesus.

6:12 and it came to pass in those days, that he went out into a
mountain to pray, and continu all night in prayer to god.

6:13 and when it wa day, he call unto him hi disciples: and of
them he chose twelve, whom also he name apostles; 6:14 simon, (whom
h also name peter,) and andrew hi brother, jame and john, philip
and bartholomew, 6:15 matthew and thomas, jame the son of alphaeus,
and simon call zelotes, 6:16 and juda the brother of james, and
juda iscariot, which also wa the traitor.

6:17 and he came down with them, and stood in the plain, and the
compani of hi disciples, and a great multitud of peopl out of all
judaea and jerusalem, and from the sea coast of tyre and sidon, which
cam to hear him, and to be heal of their diseases; 6:18 and they
that were vex with unclean spirits: and they were healed.

6:19 and the whole multitud sought to touch him: for there went
virtu out of him, and heal them all.

6:20 and he lift up hi eye on hi disciples, and said, bless be
y poor: for your is the kingdom of god.

6:21 bless are ye that hunger now: for ye shall be filled. blessed
ar ye that weep now: for ye shall laugh.

6:22 bless are ye, when men shall hate you, and when they shall
separ you from their company, and shall reproach you, and cast out
your name as evil, for the son of man' sake.

6:23 rejoic ye in that day, and leap for joy: for, behold, your
reward is great in heaven: for in the like manner did their fathers
unto the prophets.

6:24 but woe unto you that are rich! for ye have receiv your
consolation.

6:25 woe unto you that are full! for ye shall hunger. woe unto you
that laugh now! for ye shall mourn and weep.

6:26 woe unto you, when all men shall speak well of you! for so did
their father to the fals prophets.

6:27 but I say unto you which hear, love your enemies, do good to them
which hate you, 6:28 bless them that curs you, and pray for them
which despit use you.

6:29 and unto him that smiteth thee on the one cheek offer also the
other; and him that taketh away thi cloak forbid not to take thi coat
also.

6:30 give to everi man that asketh of thee; and of him that taketh
away thi good ask them not again.

6:31 and as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them
likewise.

6:32 for if ye love them which love you, what thank have ye? for
sinn also love those that love them.

6:33 and if ye do good to them which do good to you, what thank have
ye?  for sinner also do even the same.

6:34 and if ye lend to them of whom ye hope to receive, what thank
hav ye? for sinner also lend to sinners, to receiv as much again.

6:35 but love ye your enemies, and do good, and lend, hope for
noth again; and your reward shall be great, and ye shall be the
children of the highest: for he is kind unto the unthank and to the
evil.

6:36 Be ye therefor merciful, as your father also is merciful.

6:37 judg not, and ye shall not be judged: condemn not, and ye shall
not be condemned: forgive, and ye shall be forgiven: 6:38 give, and it
shal be given unto you; good measure, press down, and shaken
together, and run over, shall men give into your bosom. for with
th same measur that ye mete withal it shall be measur to you
again.

6:39 and he spake a parabl unto them, can the blind lead the blind?
shal they not both fall into the ditch?  6:40 the discipl is not
abov hi master: but everi one that is perfect shall be as his
master.

6:41 and whi beholdest thou the mote that is in thi brother' eye, but
perceivest not the beam that is in thine own eye?  6:42 either how
canst thou say to thi brother, brother, let me pull out the mote that
i in thine eye, when thou thyself beholdest not the beam that is in
thin own eye? thou hypocrite, cast out first the beam out of thine
own eye, and then shalt thou see clearli to pull out the mote that is
in thi brother' eye.

6:43 for a good tree bringeth not forth corrupt fruit; neither doth a
corrupt tree bring forth good fruit.

6:44 for everi tree is known by hi own fruit. for of thorn men do
not gather figs, nor of a brambl bush gather they grapes.

6:45 A good man out of the good treasur of hi heart bringeth forth
that which is good; and an evil man out of the evil treasur of his
heart bringeth forth that which is evil: for of the abund of the
heart hi mouth speaketh.

6:46 and whi call ye me, lord, lord, and do not the thing which i
say?  6:47 whosoev cometh to me, and heareth my sayings, and doeth
them, I will shew you to whom he is like: 6:48 He is like a man which
built an house, and dig deep, and laid the foundat on a rock:
and when the flood arose, the stream beat vehement upon that house,
and could not shake it: for it wa found upon a rock.

6:49 but he that heareth, and doeth not, is like a man that without a
found built an hous upon the earth; against which the stream did
beat vehemently, and immedi it fell; and the ruin of that house
wa great.

7:1 now when he had end all hi say in the audienc of the
people, he enter into capernaum.

7:2 and a certain centurion' servant, who wa dear unto him, was
sick, and readi to die.

7:3 and when he heard of jesus, he sent unto him the elder of the
jews, beseech him that he would come and heal hi servant.

7:4 and when they came to jesus, they besought him instantly, saying,
that he wa worthi for whom he should do this: 7:5 for he loveth our
nation, and he hath built us a synagogue.

7:6 then jesu went with them. and when he wa now not far from the
house, the centurion sent friend to him, say unto him, lord,
troubl not thyself: for I am not worthi that thou shouldest enter
und my roof: 7:7 wherefor neither thought I myself worthi to come
unto thee: but say in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

7:8 for I also am a man set under authority, have under me soldiers,
and I say unto one, go, and he goeth; and to another, come, and he
cometh; and to my servant, Do this, and he doeth it.

7:9 when jesu heard these things, he marvel at him, and turn him
about, and said unto the peopl that follow him, I say unto you, i
hav not found so great faith, no, not in israel.

7:10 and they that were sent, return to the house, found the
serv whole that had been sick.

7:11 and it came to pass the day after, that he went into a city
cal nain; and mani of hi discipl went with him, and much people.

7:12 now when he came nigh to the gate of the city, behold, there was
a dead man carri out, the onli son of hi mother, and she wa a
widow: and much peopl of the citi wa with her.

7:13 and when the lord saw her, he had compass on her, and said
unto her, weep not.

7:14 and he came and touch the bier: and they that bare him stood
still.

and he said, young man, I say unto thee, arise.

7:15 and he that wa dead sat up, and began to speak. and he delivered
him to hi mother.

7:16 and there came a fear on all: and they glorifi god, saying,
that a great prophet is risen up among us; and, that god hath visited
hi people.

7:17 and thi rumour of him went forth throughout all judaea, and
throughout all the region round about.

7:18 and the discipl of john shew him of all these things.

7:19 and john call unto him two of hi discipl sent them to
jesus, saying, art thou he that should come? or look we for another?
7:20 when the men were come unto him, they said, john baptist hath
sent us unto thee, saying, art thou he that should come? or look we
for another?  7:21 and in that same hour he cure mani of their
infirm and plagues, and of evil spirits; and unto mani that were
blind he gave sight.

7:22 then jesu answer said unto them, Go your way, and tell john
what thing ye have seen and heard; how that the blind see, the lame
walk, the leper are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, to
th poor the gospel is preached.

7:23 and bless is he, whosoev shall not be offend in me.

7:24 and when the messeng of john were departed, he began to speak
unto the peopl concern john, what went ye out into the wilderness
for to see?  A reed shaken with the wind?  7:25 but what went ye out
for to see? A man cloth in soft raiment?  behold, they which are
gorg apparelled, and live delicately, are in kings' courts.

7:26 but what went ye out for to see? A prophet? yea, I say unto you,
and much more than a prophet.

7:27 thi is he, of whom it is written, behold, I send my messenger
befor thi face, which shall prepar thi way befor thee.

7:28 for I say unto you, among those that are born of women there is
not a greater prophet than john the baptist: but he that is least in
th kingdom of god is greater than he.

7:29 and all the peopl that heard him, and the publicans, justified
god, be baptiz with the baptism of john.

7:30 but the pharise and lawyer reject the counsel of god against
themselves, be not baptiz of him.

7:31 and the lord said, whereunto then shall I liken the men of this
generation? and to what are they like?  7:32 they are like unto
children sit in the marketplace, and call one to another, and
saying, We have pipe unto you, and ye have not danced; we have
mourn to you, and ye have not wept.

7:33 for john the baptist came neither eat bread nor drink wine;
and ye say, He hath a devil.

7:34 the son of man is come eat and drinking; and ye say, behold a
glutton man, and a winebibber, a friend of publican and sinners!
7:35 but wisdom is justifi of all her children.

7:36 and one of the pharise desir him that he would eat with him.
and he went into the pharisee' house, and sat down to meat.

7:37 and, behold, a woman in the city, which wa a sinner, when she
knew that jesu sat at meat in the pharisee' house, brought an
alabast box of ointment, 7:38 and stood at hi feet behind him
weeping, and began to wash hi feet with tears, and did wipe them with
th hair of her head, and kiss hi feet, and anoint them with the
ointment.

7:39 now when the pharise which had bidden him saw it, he spake
within himself, saying, thi man, if he were a prophet, would have
known who and what manner of woman thi is that toucheth him: for she
i a sinner.

7:40 and jesu answer said unto him, simon, I have somewhat to say
unto thee. and he saith, master, say on.

7:41 there wa a certain creditor which had two debtors: the one owed
f hundr pence, and the other fifty.

7:42 and when they had noth to pay, he frankli forgav them both.
tel me therefore, which of them will love him most?  7:43 simon
answ and said, I suppos that he, to whom he forgav most.

and he said unto him, thou hast rightli judged.

7:44 and he turn to the woman, and said unto simon, seest thou this
woman? I enter into thine house, thou gavest me no water for my
feet: but she hath wash my feet with tears, and wipe them with the
hair of her head.

7:45 thou gavest me no kiss: but thi woman sinc the time I came in
hath not ceas to kiss my feet.

7:46 My head with oil thou didst not anoint: but thi woman hath
anoint my feet with ointment.

7:47 wherefor I say unto thee, her sins, which are many, are
forgiven; for she love much: but to whom littl is forgiven, the same
loveth little.

7:48 and he said unto her, thi sin are forgiven.

7:49 and they that sat at meat with him began to say within
themselves, who is thi that forgiveth sin also?  7:50 and he said to
th woman, thi faith hath save thee; go in peace.

8:1 and it came to pass afterward, that he went throughout everi city
and village, preach and shew the glad tide of the kingdom of
god: and the twelv were with him, 8:2 and certain women, which had
been heal of evil spirit and infirmities, mari call magdalene,
out of whom went seven devils, 8:3 and joanna the wife of chuza
herod' steward, and susanna, and mani others, which minist unto
him of their substance.

8:4 and when much peopl were gather together, and were come to him
out of everi city, he spake by a parable: 8:5 A sower went out to sow
hi seed: and as he sowed, some fell by the way side; and it was
trodden down, and the fowl of the air devour it.

8:6 and some fell upon a rock; and as soon as it wa sprung up, it
with away, becaus it lack moisture.

8:7 and some fell among thorns; and the thorn sprang up with it, and
chok it.

8:8 and other fell on good ground, and sprang up, and bare fruit an
hundredfold. and when he had said these things, he cried, He that hath
ear to hear, let him hear.

8:9 and hi discipl ask him, saying, what might thi parabl be?
8:10 and he said, unto you it is given to know the mysteri of the
kingdom of god: but to other in parables; that see they might not
see, and hear they might not understand.

8:11 now the parabl is this: the seed is the word of god.

8:12 those by the way side are they that hear; then cometh the devil,
and taketh away the word out of their hearts, lest they should believe
and be saved.

8:13 they on the rock are they, which, when they hear, receiv the
word with joy; and these have no root, which for a while believe, and
in time of temptat fall away.

8:14 and that which fell among thorn are they, which, when they have
heard, go forth, and are choke with care and rich and pleasur of
thi life, and bring no fruit to perfection.

8:15 but that on the good ground are they, which in an honest and good
heart, have heard the word, keep it, and bring forth fruit with
patience.

8:16 No man, when he hath light a candle, covereth it with a vessel,
or putteth it under a bed; but setteth it on a candlestick, that they
which enter in may see the light.

8:17 for noth is secret, that shall not be made manifest; neither
ani thing hid, that shall not be known and come abroad.

8:18 take heed therefor how ye hear: for whosoev hath, to him shall
b given; and whosoev hath not, from him shall be taken even that
which he seemeth to have.

8:19 then came to him hi mother and hi brethren, and could not come
at him for the press.

8:20 and it wa told him by certain which said, thi mother and thy
brethren stand without, desir to see thee.

8:21 and he answer and said unto them, My mother and my brethren are
thes which hear the word of god, and do it.

8:22 now it came to pass on a certain day, that he went into a ship
with hi disciples: and he said unto them, let us go over unto the
oth side of the lake. and they launch forth.

8:23 but as they sail he fell asleep: and there came down a storm of
wind on the lake; and they were fill with water, and were in
jeopardy.

8:24 and they came to him, and awok him, saying, master, master, we
perish. then he arose, and rebuk the wind and the rage of the
water: and they ceased, and there wa a calm.

8:25 and he said unto them, where is your faith? and they be afraid
wondered, say one to another, what manner of man is this! for he
commandeth even the wind and water, and they obey him.

8:26 and they arriv at the countri of the gadarenes, which is over
against galilee.

8:27 and when he went forth to land, there met him out of the citi a
certain man, which had devil long time, and ware no clothes, neither
abod in ani house, but in the tombs.

8:28 when he saw jesus, he cri out, and fell down befor him, and
with a loud voic said, what have I to do with thee, jesus, thou son
of god most high? I beseech thee, torment me not.

8:29 (for he had command the unclean spirit to come out of the man.
for oftentim it had caught him: and he wa kept bound with chains
and in fetters; and he brake the bands, and wa driven of the devil
into the wilderness.)  8:30 and jesu ask him, saying, what is thy
name? and he said, legion: becaus mani devil were enter into him.

8:31 and they besought him that he would not command them to go out
into the deep.

8:32 and there wa there an herd of mani swine feed on the
mountain: and they besought him that he would suffer them to enter
into them. and he suffer them.

8:33 then went the devil out of the man, and enter into the swine:
and the herd ran violent down a steep place into the lake, and were
choked.

8:34 when they that fed them saw what wa done, they fled, and went
and told it in the citi and in the country.

8:35 then they went out to see what wa done; and came to jesus, and
found the man, out of whom the devil were departed, sit at the
feet of jesus, clothed, and in hi right mind: and they were afraid.

8:36 they also which saw it told them by what mean he that was
possess of the devil wa healed.

8:37 then the whole multitud of the countri of the gadaren round
about besought him to depart from them; for they were taken with great
fear: and he went up into the ship, and return back again.

8:38 now the man out of whom the devil were depart besought him
that he might be with him: but jesu sent him away, saying, 8:39
return to thine own house, and shew how great thing god hath done
unto thee. and he went hi way, and publish throughout the whole
c how great thing jesu had done unto him.

8:40 and it came to pass, that, when jesu wa returned, the people
gladli receiv him: for they were all wait for him.

8:41 and, behold, there came a man name jairus, and he wa a ruler of
th synagogue: and he fell down at jesus' feet, and besought him that
h would come into hi house: 8:42 for he had one onli daughter, about
twelv year of age, and she lay a dying. but as he went the people
throng him.

8:43 and a woman have an issu of blood twelv years, which had
spent all her live upon physicians, neither could be heal of any,
8:44 came behind him, and touch the border of hi garment: and
immedi her issu of blood stanched.

8:45 and jesu said, who touch me? when all denied, peter and they
that were with him said, master, the multitud throng thee and press
thee, and sayest thou, who touch me?  8:46 and jesu said, somebody
hath touch me: for I perceiv that virtu is gone out of me.

8:47 and when the woman saw that she wa not hid, she came trembling,
and fall down befor him, she declar unto him befor all the
peopl for what caus she had touch him, and how she wa healed
immediately.

8:48 and he said unto her, daughter, be of good comfort: thi faith
hath made thee whole; go in peace.

8:49 while he yet spake, there cometh one from the ruler of the
synagogue' house, say to him, thi daughter is dead; troubl not
th master.

8:50 but when jesu heard it, he answer him, saying, fear not:
believ only, and she shall be made whole.

8:51 and when he came into the house, he suffer no man to go in,
sav peter, and james, and john, and the father and the mother of the
maiden.

8:52 and all wept, and bewail her: but he said, weep not; she is not
dead, but sleepeth.

8:53 and they laugh him to scorn, know that she wa dead.

8:54 and he put them all out, and took her by the hand, and called,
saying, maid, arise.

8:55 and her spirit came again, and she aros straightway: and he
command to give her meat.

8:56 and her parent were astonished: but he charg them that they
should tell no man what wa done.

9:1 then he call hi twelv discipl together, and gave them power
and author over all devils, and to cure diseases.

9:2 and he sent them to preach the kingdom of god, and to heal the
sick.

9:3 and he said unto them, take noth for your journey, neither
staves, nor scrip, neither bread, neither money; neither have two
coat apiece.

9:4 and whatsoev hous ye enter into, there abide, and thence
depart.

9:5 and whosoev will not receiv you, when ye go out of that city,
shak off the veri dust from your feet for a testimoni against them.

9:6 and they departed, and went through the towns, preach the
gospel, and heal everi where.

9:7 now herod the tetrarch heard of all that wa done by him: and he
wa perplexed, becaus that it wa said of some, that john wa risen
from the dead; 9:8 and of some, that elia had appeared; and of
others, that one of the old prophet wa risen again.

9:9 and herod said, john have I beheaded: but who is this, of whom i
hear such things? and he desir to see him.

9:10 and the apostles, when they were returned, told him all that they
had done. and he took them, and went asid privat into a desert
plac belong to the citi call bethsaida.

9:11 and the people, when they knew it, follow him: and he received
them, and spake unto them of the kingdom of god, and heal them that
had need of healing.

9:12 and when the day began to wear away, then came the twelve, and
said unto him, send the multitud away, that they may go into the
town and countri round about, and lodge, and get victuals: for we are
her in a desert place.

9:13 but he said unto them, give ye them to eat. and they said, we
hav no more but five loav and two fishes; except we should go and
buy meat for all thi people.

9:14 for they were about five thousand men. and he said to his
disciples, make them sit down by fifti in a company.

9:15 and they did so, and made them all sit down.

9:16 then he took the five loav and the two fishes, and look up
to heaven, he bless them, and brake, and gave to the discipl to
set befor the multitude.

9:17 and they did eat, and were all filled: and there wa taken up of
frag that remain to them twelv baskets.

9:18 and it came to pass, as he wa alon praying, hi discipl were
with him: and he ask them, saying, whom say the peopl that I am?
9:19 they answer said, john the baptist; but some say, elias; and
oth say, that one of the old prophet is risen again.

9:20 He said unto them, but whom say ye that I am? peter answering
said, the christ of god.

9:21 and he straitli charg them, and command them to tell no man
that thing; 9:22 saying, the son of man must suffer mani things, and
b reject of the elder and chief priest and scribes, and be slain,
and be rais the third day.

9:23 and he said to them all, If ani man will come after me, let him
deni himself, and take up hi cross daily, and follow me.

9:24 for whosoev will save hi life shall lose it: but whosoever
wil lose hi life for my sake, the same shall save it.

9:25 for what is a man advantaged, if he gain the whole world, and
los himself, or be cast away?  9:26 for whosoev shall be asham of
m and of my words, of him shall the son of man be ashamed, when he
shal come in hi own glory, and in hi father's, and of the holy
angels.

9:27 but I tell you of a truth, there be some stand here, which
shal not tast of death, till they see the kingdom of god.

9:28 and it came to pass about an eight day after these sayings, he
took peter and john and james, and went up into a mountain to pray.

9:29 and as he prayed, the fashion of hi counten wa altered, and
hi raiment wa white and glistering.

9:30 and, behold, there talk with him two men, which were mose and
elias: 9:31 who appear in glory, and spake of hi deceas which he
should accomplish at jerusalem.

9:32 but peter and they that were with him were heavi with sleep: and
when they were awake, they saw hi glory, and the two men that stood
with him.

9:33 and it came to pass, as they depart from him, peter said unto
jesus, master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three
tabernacles; one for thee, and one for moses, and one for elias: not
know what he said.

9:34 while he thu spake, there came a cloud, and overshadow them:
and they fear as they enter into the cloud.

9:35 and there came a voic out of the cloud, saying, thi is my
belov son: hear him.

9:36 and when the voic wa past, jesu wa found alone. and they kept
it close, and told no man in those day ani of those thing which they
had seen.

9:37 and it came to pass, that on the next day, when they were come
down from the hill, much peopl met him.

9:38 and, behold, a man of the compani cri out, saying, master, i
beseech thee, look upon my son: for he is mine onli child.

9:39 and, lo, a spirit taketh him, and he suddenli crieth out; and it
teareth him that he foameth again, and bruis him hardli departeth
from him.

9:40 and I besought thi discipl to cast him out; and they could not.

9:41 and jesu answer said, O faithless and pervers generation,
how long shall I be with you, and suffer you? bring thi son hither.

9:42 and as he wa yet a coming, the devil threw him down, and tare
him.

and jesu rebuk the unclean spirit, and heal the child, and
deliv him again to hi father.

9:43 and they were all amaz at the mighti power of god. but while
they wonder everi one at all thing which jesu did, he said unto
hi disciples, 9:44 let these say sink down into your ears: for
th son of man shall be deliv into the hand of men.

9:45 but they understood not thi saying, and it wa hid from them,
that they perceiv it not: and they fear to ask him of that saying.

9:46 then there aros a reason among them, which of them should be
greatest.

9:47 and jesus, perceiv the thought of their heart, took a child,
and set him by him, 9:48 and said unto them, whosoev shall receive
thi child in my name receiveth me: and whosoev shall receiv me
receiveth him that sent me: for he that is least among you all, the
sam shall be great.

9:49 and john answer and said, master, we saw one cast out devils
in thi name; and we forbad him, becaus he followeth not with us.

9:50 and jesu said unto him, forbid him not: for he that is not
against us is for us.

9:51 and it came to pass, when the time wa come that he should be
receiv up, he stedfastli set hi face to go to jerusalem, 9:52 and
sent messeng befor hi face: and they went, and enter into a
villag of the samaritans, to make readi for him.

9:53 and they did not receiv him, becaus hi face wa as though he
would go to jerusalem.

9:54 and when hi discipl jame and john saw this, they said, lord,
wilt thou that we command fire to come down from heaven, and consume
them, even as elia did?  9:55 but he turned, and rebuk them, and
said, Ye know not what manner of spirit ye are of.

9:56 for the son of man is not come to destroy men' lives, but to
sav them. and they went to anoth village.

9:57 and it came to pass, that, as they went in the way, a certain man
said unto him, lord, I will follow thee whithersoev thou goest.

9:58 and jesu said unto him, fox have holes, and bird of the air
hav nests; but the son of man hath not where to lay hi head.

9:59 and he said unto another, follow me. but he said, lord, suffer me
first to go and buri my father.

9:60 jesu said unto him, let the dead buri their dead: but go thou
and preach the kingdom of god.

9:61 and anoth also said, lord, I will follow thee; but let me first
go bid them farewell, which are at home at my house.

9:62 and jesu said unto him, No man, have put hi hand to the
plough, and look back, is fit for the kingdom of god.

10:1 after these thing the lord appoint other seventi also, and
sent them two and two befor hi face into everi citi and place,
whith he himself would come.

10:2 therefor said he unto them, the harvest truli is great, but the
labour are few: pray ye therefor the lord of the harvest, that he
would send forth labour into hi harvest.

10:3 Go your ways: behold, I send you forth as lamb among wolves.

10:4 carri neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes: and salut no man by
th way.

10:5 and into whatsoev hous ye enter, first say, peac be to this
house.

10:6 and if the son of peac be there, your peac shall rest upon it:
if not, it shall turn to you again.

10:7 and in the same hous remain, eat and drink such thing as
they give: for the labour is worthi of hi hire. Go not from house
to house.

10:8 and into whatsoev citi ye enter, and they receiv you, eat such
th as are set befor you: 10:9 and heal the sick that are therein,
and say unto them, the kingdom of god is come nigh unto you.

10:10 but into whatsoev citi ye enter, and they receiv you not, go
your way out into the street of the same, and say, 10:11 even the
veri dust of your city, which cleaveth on us, we do wipe off against
you: notwithstand be ye sure of this, that the kingdom of god is
com nigh unto you.

10:12 but I say unto you, that it shall be more toler in that day
for sodom, than for that city.

10:13 woe unto thee, chorazin! woe unto thee, bethsaida! for if the
mighti work had been done in tyre and sidon, which have been done in
you, they had a great while ago repented, sit in sackcloth and
ashes.

10:14 but it shall be more toler for tyre and sidon at the
judgment, than for you.

10:15 and thou, capernaum, which art exalt to heaven, shalt be
thrust down to hell.

10:16 He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you
despiseth me; and he that despiseth me despiseth him that sent me.

10:17 and the seventi return again with joy, saying, lord, even the
devil are subject unto us through thi name.

10:18 and he said unto them, I beheld satan as lightn fall from
heaven.

10:19 behold, I give unto you power to tread on serpent and
scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy: and noth shall by
ani mean hurt you.

10:20 notwithstand in thi rejoic not, that the spirit are
subject unto you; but rather rejoice, becaus your name are written
in heaven.

10:21 In that hour jesu rejoic in spirit, and said, I thank thee, o
father, lord of heaven and earth, that thou hast hid these thing from
th wise and prudent, and hast reveal them unto babes: even so,
father; for so it seem good in thi sight.

10:22 all thing are deliv to me of my father: and no man knoweth
who the son is, but the father; and who the father is, but the son,
and he to whom the son will reveal him.

10:23 and he turn him unto hi disciples, and said privately,
bless are the eye which see the thing that ye see: 10:24 for i
tel you, that mani prophet and king have desir to see those
th which ye see, and have not seen them; and to hear those things
which ye hear, and have not heard them.

10:25 and, behold, a certain lawyer stood up, and tempt him, saying,
master, what shall I do to inherit etern life?  10:26 He said unto
him, what is written in the law? how readest thou?  10:27 and he
answ said, thou shalt love the lord thi god with all thi heart,
and with all thi soul, and with all thi strength, and with all thy
mind; and thi neighbour as thyself.

10:28 and he said unto him, thou hast answer right: thi do, and
thou shalt live.

10:29 but he, will to justifi himself, said unto jesus, and who is
mi neighbour?  10:30 and jesu answer said, A certain man went down
from jerusalem to jericho, and fell among thieves, which strip him
of hi raiment, and wound him, and departed, leav him half dead.

10:31 and by chanc there came down a certain priest that way: and
when he saw him, he pass by on the other side.

10:32 and likewis a levite, when he wa at the place, came and looked
on him, and pass by on the other side.

10:33 but a certain samaritan, as he journeyed, came where he was: and
when he saw him, he had compass on him, 10:34 and went to him, and
bound up hi wounds, pour in oil and wine, and set him on hi own
beast, and brought him to an inn, and took care of him.

10:35 and on the morrow when he departed, he took out two pence, and
gav them to the host, and said unto him, take care of him; and
whatsoev thou spendest more, when I come again, I will repay thee.

10:36 which now of these three, thinkest thou, wa neighbour unto him
that fell among the thieves?  10:37 and he said, He that shew mercy
on him. then said jesu unto him, go, and do thou likewise.

10:38 now it came to pass, as they went, that he enter into a
certain village: and a certain woman name martha receiv him into
h house.

10:39 and she had a sister call mary, which also sat at jesus' feet,
and heard hi word.

10:40 but martha wa cumber about much serving, and came to him, and
said, lord, dost thou not care that my sister hath left me to serve
alone?  bid her therefor that she help me.

10:41 and jesu answer and said unto her, martha, martha, thou art
car and troubl about mani things: 10:42 but one thing is
needful: and mari hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken
away from her.

11:1 and it came to pass, that, as he wa pray in a certain place,
when he ceased, one of hi discipl said unto him, lord, teach us to
pray, as john also taught hi disciples.

11:2 and he said unto them, when ye pray, say, our father which art in
heaven, hallow be thi name. thi kingdom come. thi will be done, as
in heaven, so in earth.

11:3 give us day by day our daili bread.

11:4 and forgiv us our sins; for we also forgiv everi one that is
indebt to us. and lead us not into temptation; but deliv us from
evil.

11:5 and he said unto them, which of you shall have a friend, and
shal go unto him at midnight, and say unto him, friend, lend me three
loaves; 11:6 for a friend of mine in hi journey is come to me, and i
hav noth to set befor him?  11:7 and he from within shall answer
and say, troubl me not: the door is now shut, and my children are
with me in bed; I cannot rise and give thee.

11:8 I say unto you, though he will not rise and give him, becaus he
i hi friend, yet becaus of hi importun he will rise and give
him as mani as he needeth.

11:9 and I say unto you, ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye
shal find; knock, and it shall be open unto you.

11:10 for everi one that asketh receiveth; and he that seeketh
findeth; and to him that knocketh it shall be opened.

11:11 If a son shall ask bread of ani of you that is a father, will he
giv him a stone? or if he ask a fish, will he for a fish give him a
serpent?  11:12 Or if he shall ask an egg, will he offer him a
scorpion?  11:13 If ye then, be evil, know how to give good gifts
unto your children: how much more shall your heavenli father give the
holi spirit to them that ask him?  11:14 and he wa cast out a
devil, and it wa dumb. and it came to pass, when the devil wa gone
out, the dumb spake; and the peopl wondered.

11:15 but some of them said, He casteth out devil through beelzebub
th chief of the devils.

11:16 and others, tempt him, sought of him a sign from heaven.

11:17 but he, know their thoughts, said unto them, everi kingdom
divid against itself is brought to desolation; and a hous divided
against a hous falleth.

11:18 If satan also be divid against himself, how shall hi kingdom
stand? becaus ye say that I cast out devil through beelzebub.

11:19 and if I by beelzebub cast out devils, by whom do your son cast
them out? therefor shall they be your judges.

11:20 but if I with the finger of god cast out devils, no doubt the
kingdom of god is come upon you.

11:21 when a strong man arm keepeth hi palace, hi good are in
peace: 11:22 but when a stronger than he shall come upon him, and
overcom him, he taketh from him all hi armour wherein he trusted,
and divideth hi spoils.

11:23 He that is not with me is against me: and he that gathereth not
with me scattereth.

11:24 when the unclean spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh through
dri places, seek rest; and find none, he saith, I will return
unto my hous whenc I came out.

11:25 and when he cometh, he findeth it swept and garnished.

11:26 then goeth he, and taketh to him seven other spirit more wicked
than himself; and they enter in, and dwell there: and the last state
of that man is wors than the first.

11:27 and it came to pass, as he spake these things, a certain woman
of the compani lift up her voice, and said unto him, bless is the
womb that bare thee, and the pap which thou hast sucked.

11:28 but he said, yea rather, bless are they that hear the word of
god, and keep it.

11:29 and when the peopl were gather thick together, he began to
say, thi is an evil generation: they seek a sign; and there shall no
sign be given it, but the sign of jona the prophet.

11:30 for as jona wa a sign unto the ninevites, so shall also the
son of man be to thi generation.

11:31 the queen of the south shall rise up in the judgment with the
men of thi generation, and condemn them: for she came from the utmost
part of the earth to hear the wisdom of solomon; and, behold, a
great than solomon is here.

11:32 the men of ninev shall rise up in the judgment with this
generation, and shall condemn it: for they repent at the preaching
of jonas; and, behold, a greater than jona is here.

11:33 No man, when he hath light a candle, putteth it in a secret
place, neither under a bushel, but on a candlestick, that they which
com in may see the light.

11:34 the light of the bodi is the eye: therefor when thine eye is
single, thi whole bodi also is full of light; but when thine eye is
evil, thi bodi also is full of darkness.

11:35 take heed therefor that the light which is in thee be not
darkness.

11:36 If thi whole bodi therefor be full of light, have no part
dark, the whole shall be full of light, as when the bright shine of
a candl doth give thee light.

11:37 and as he spake, a certain pharise besought him to dine with
him: and he went in, and sat down to meat.

11:38 and when the pharise saw it, he marvel that he had not first
wash befor dinner.

11:39 and the lord said unto him, now do ye pharise make clean the
outsid of the cup and the platter; but your inward part is full of
raven and wickedness.

11:40 Ye fools, did not he that made that which is without make that
which is within also?  11:41 but rather give alm of such thing as ye
have; and, behold, all thing are clean unto you.

11:42 but woe unto you, pharisees! for ye tith mint and rue and all
mann of herbs, and pass over judgment and the love of god: these
ought ye to have done, and not to leav the other undone.

11:43 woe unto you, pharisees! for ye love the uppermost seat in the
synagogues, and greet in the markets.

11:44 woe unto you, scribe and pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are as
grav which appear not, and the men that walk over them are not aware
of them.

11:45 then answer one of the lawyers, and said unto him, master,
thu say thou reproachest us also.

11:46 and he said, woe unto you also, ye lawyers! for ye lade men with
burden grievou to be borne, and ye yourselv touch not the burdens
with one of your fingers.

11:47 woe unto you! for ye build the sepulchr of the prophets, and
your father kill them.

11:48 truli ye bear wit that ye allow the deed of your fathers:
for they inde kill them, and ye build their sepulchres.

11:49 therefor also said the wisdom of god, I will send them prophets
and apostles, and some of them they shall slay and persecute: 11:50
that the blood of all the prophets, which wa shed from the foundation
of the world, may be requir of thi generation; 11:51 from the blood
of abel unto the blood of zacharia which perish between the altar
and the temple: verili I say unto you, It shall be requir of this
generation.

11:52 woe unto you, lawyers! for ye have taken away the key of
knowledge: ye enter not in yourselves, and them that were entering
in ye hindered.

11:53 and as he said these thing unto them, the scribe and the
pharise began to urg him vehemently, and to provok him to speak of
mani things: 11:54 lay wait for him, and seek to catch something
out of hi mouth, that they might accus him.

12:1 In the mean time, when there were gather togeth an
innumer multitud of people, insomuch that they trode one upon
another, he began to say unto hi discipl first of all, bewar ye of
th leaven of the pharisees, which is hypocrisy.

12:2 for there is noth covered, that shall not be revealed; neither
hid, that shall not be known.

12:3 therefor whatsoev ye have spoken in dark shall be heard in
th light; and that which ye have spoken in the ear in closet shall
b proclaim upon the housetops.

12:4 and I say unto you my friends, Be not afraid of them that kill
th body, and after that have no more that they can do.

12:5 but I will forewarn you whom ye shall fear: fear him, which after
h hath kill hath power to cast into hell; yea, I say unto you, fear
him.

12:6 are not five sparrow sold for two farthings, and not one of them
i forgotten befor god?  12:7 but even the veri hair of your head
ar all numbered. fear not therefore: ye are of more valu than many
sparrows.

12:8 also I say unto you, whosoev shall confess me befor men, him
shal the son of man also confess befor the angel of god: 12:9 but
h that denieth me befor men shall be deni befor the angel of
god.

12:10 and whosoev shall speak a word against the son of man, it
shal be forgiven him: but unto him that blasphemeth against the holy
ghost it shall not be forgiven.

12:11 and when they bring you unto the synagogues, and unto
magistrates, and powers, take ye no thought how or what thing ye shall
answer, or what ye shall say: 12:12 for the holi ghost shall teach you
in the same hour what ye ought to say.

12:13 and one of the compani said unto him, master, speak to my
brother, that he divid the inherit with me.

12:14 and he said unto him, man, who made me a judg or a divid over
you?  12:15 and he said unto them, take heed, and bewar of
covetousness: for a man' life consisteth not in the abund of the
th which he possesseth.

12:16 and he spake a parabl unto them, saying, the ground of a
certain rich man brought forth plentifully: 12:17 and he thought
within himself, saying, what shall I do, becaus I have no room where
to bestow my fruits?  12:18 and he said, thi will I do: I will pull
down my barns, and build greater; and there will I bestow all my
fruit and my goods.

12:19 and I will say to my soul, soul, thou hast much good laid up
for mani years; take thine ease, eat, drink, and be merry.

12:20 but god said unto him, thou fool, thi night thi soul shall be
requir of thee: then whose shall those thing be, which thou hast
provided?  12:21 So is he that layeth up treasur for himself, and is
not rich toward god.

12:22 and he said unto hi disciples, therefor I say unto you, take
no thought for your life, what ye shall eat; neither for the body,
what ye shall put on.

12:23 the life is more than meat, and the bodi is more than raiment.

12:24 consid the ravens: for they neither sow nor reap; which
neith have storehous nor barn; and god feedeth them: how much more
ar ye better than the fowls?  12:25 and which of you with taking
thought can add to hi statur one cubit?  12:26 If ye then be not
abl to do that thing which is least, whi take ye thought for the
rest?  12:27 consid the lili how they grow: they toil not, they
spin not; and yet I say unto you, that solomon in all hi glori was
not array like one of these.

12:28 If then god so cloth the grass, which is to day in the field,
and to morrow is cast into the oven; how much more will he cloth you,
o ye of littl faith?  12:29 and seek not ye what ye shall eat, or
what ye shall drink, neither be ye of doubt mind.

12:30 for all these thing do the nation of the world seek after: and
your father knoweth that ye have need of these things.

12:31 but rather seek ye the kingdom of god; and all these things
shal be ad unto you.

12:32 fear not, littl flock; for it is your father' good pleasur to
giv you the kingdom.

12:33 sell that ye have, and give alms; provid yourselv bag which
wax not old, a treasur in the heaven that faileth not, where no
thief approacheth, neither moth corrupteth.

12:34 for where your treasur is, there will your heart be also.

12:35 let your loin be gird about, and your light burning; 12:36
and ye yourselv like unto men that wait for their lord, when he will
return from the wedding; that when he cometh and knocketh, they may
open unto him immediately.

12:37 bless are those servants, whom the lord when he cometh shall
find watching: verili I say unto you, that he shall gird himself, and
mak them to sit down to meat, and will come forth and serv them.

12:38 and if he shall come in the second watch, or come in the third
watch, and find them so, bless are those servants.

12:39 and thi know, that if the goodman of the hous had known what
hour the thief would come, he would have watched, and not have
suff hi hous to be broken through.

12:40 Be ye therefor readi also: for the son of man cometh at an hour
when ye think not.

12:41 then peter said unto him, lord, speakest thou thi parabl unto
us, or even to all?  12:42 and the lord said, who then is that
faith and wise steward, whom hi lord shall make ruler over his
household, to give them their portion of meat in due season?  12:43
bless is that servant, whom hi lord when he cometh shall find so
doing.

12:44 Of a truth I say unto you, that he will make him ruler over all
that he hath.

12:45 but and if that servant say in hi heart, My lord delayeth his
coming; and shall begin to beat the menserv and maidens, and to
eat and drink, and to be drunken; 12:46 the lord of that servant will
com in a day when he looketh not for him, and at an hour when he is
not aware, and will cut him in sunder, and will appoint him his
port with the unbelievers.

12:47 and that servant, which knew hi lord' will, and prepar not
himself, neither did accord to hi will, shall be beaten with many
stripes.

12:48 but he that knew not, and did commit thing worthi of stripes,
shal be beaten with few stripes. for unto whomsoev much is given,
of him shall be much required: and to whom men have commit much, of
him they will ask the more.

12:49 I am come to send fire on the earth; and what will I, if it be
alreadi kindled?  12:50 but I have a baptism to be baptiz with; and
how am I straiten till it be accomplished!  12:51 suppos ye that i
am come to give peac on earth? I tell you, nay; but rather division:
12:52 for from henceforth there shall be five in one hous divided,
thre against two, and two against three.

12:53 the father shall be divid against the son, and the son against
th father; the mother against the daughter, and the daughter against
th mother; the mother in law against her daughter in law, and the
daught in law against her mother in law.

12:54 and he said also to the people, when ye see a cloud rise out of
th west, straightway ye say, there cometh a shower; and so it is.

12:55 and when ye see the south wind blow, ye say, there will be heat;
and it cometh to pass.

12:56 Ye hypocrites, ye can discern the face of the sky and of the
earth; but how is it that ye do not discern thi time?  12:57 yea, and
whi even of yourselv judg ye not what is right?  12:58 when thou
goest with thine adversari to the magistrate, as thou art in the way,
giv dilig that thou mayest be deliv from him; lest he hale
the to the judge, and the judg deliv thee to the officer, and the
offic cast thee into prison.

12:59 I tell thee, thou shalt not depart thence, till thou hast paid
th veri last mite.

13:1 there were present at that season some that told him of the
galilaeans, whose blood pilat had mingl with their sacrifices.

13:2 and jesu answer said unto them, suppos ye that these
galilaean were sinner abov all the galilaeans, becaus they
suff such things?  13:3 I tell you, nay: but, except ye repent, ye
shal all likewis perish.

13:4 Or those eighteen, upon whom the tower in siloam fell, and slew
them, think ye that they were sinner abov all men that dwelt in
jerusalem?  13:5 I tell you, nay: but, except ye repent, ye shall all
likewis perish.

13:6 He spake also thi parable; A certain man had a fig tree planted
in hi vineyard; and he came and sought fruit thereon, and found none.

13:7 then said he unto the dresser of hi vineyard, behold, these
thre year I come seek fruit on thi fig tree, and find none: cut
it down; whi cumbereth it the ground?  13:8 and he answer said unto
him, lord, let it alon thi year also, till I shall dig about it, and
dung it: 13:9 and if it bear fruit, well: and if not, then after that
thou shalt cut it down.

13:10 and he wa teach in one of the synagogu on the sabbath.

13:11 and, behold, there wa a woman which had a spirit of infirmity
eighteen years, and wa bow together, and could in no wise lift up
herself.

13:12 and when jesu saw her, he call her to him, and said unto her,
woman, thou art loos from thine infirmity.

13:13 and he laid hi hand on her: and immedi she wa made
straight, and glorifi god.

13:14 and the ruler of the synagogu answer with indignation,
becaus that jesu had heal on the sabbath day, and said unto the
people, there are six day in which men ought to work: in them
therefor come and be healed, and not on the sabbath day.

13:15 the lord then answer him, and said, thou hypocrite, doth not
each one of you on the sabbath loos hi ox or hi ass from the stall,
and lead him away to watering?  13:16 and ought not thi woman, being
a daughter of abraham, whom satan hath bound, lo, these eighteen
years, be loos from thi bond on the sabbath day?  13:17 and when he
had said these things, all hi adversari were ashamed: and all the
peopl rejoic for all the gloriou thing that were done by him.

13:18 then said he, unto what is the kingdom of god like? and
whereunto shall I resembl it?  13:19 It is like a grain of mustard
seed, which a man took, and cast into hi garden; and it grew, and
wax a great tree; and the fowl of the air lodg in the branch of
it.

13:20 and again he said, whereunto shall I liken the kingdom of god?
13:21 It is like leaven, which a woman took and hid in three measures
of meal, till the whole wa leavened.

13:22 and he went through the citi and villages, teaching, and
journey toward jerusalem.

13:23 then said one unto him, lord, are there few that be saved? and
h said unto them, 13:24 strive to enter in at the strait gate: for
many, I say unto you, will seek to enter in, and shall not be able.

13:25 when onc the master of the hous is risen up, and hath shut to
th door, and ye begin to stand without, and to knock at the door,
saying, lord, lord, open unto us; and he shall answer and say unto
you, I know you not whenc ye are: 13:26 then shall ye begin to say,
w have eaten and drunk in thi presence, and thou hast taught in our
streets.

13:27 but he shall say, I tell you, I know you not whenc ye are;
depart from me, all ye worker of iniquity.

13:28 there shall be weep and gnash of teeth, when ye shall see
abraham, and isaac, and jacob, and all the prophets, in the kingdom of
god, and you yourselv thrust out.

13:29 and they shall come from the east, and from the west, and from
th north, and from the south, and shall sit down in the kingdom of
god.

13:30 and, behold, there are last which shall be first, and there are
first which shall be last.

13:31 the same day there came certain of the pharisees, say unto
him, get thee out, and depart hence: for herod will kill thee.

13:32 and he said unto them, Go ye, and tell that fox, behold, I cast
out devils, and I do cure to day and to morrow, and the third day i
shal be perfected.

13:33 nevertheless I must walk to day, and to morrow, and the day
following: for it cannot be that a prophet perish out of jerusalem.

13:34 O jerusalem, jerusalem, which killest the prophets, and stonest
them that are sent unto thee; how often would I have gather thy
children together, as a hen doth gather her brood under her wings, and
y would not!  13:35 behold, your hous is left unto you desolate: and
verili I say unto you, Ye shall not see me, until the time come when
y shall say, bless is he that cometh in the name of the lord.

14:1 and it came to pass, as he went into the hous of one of the
chief pharise to eat bread on the sabbath day, that they watched
him.

14:2 and, behold, there wa a certain man befor him which had the
dropsy.

14:3 and jesu answer spake unto the lawyer and pharisees, saying,
i it law to heal on the sabbath day?  14:4 and they held their
peace. and he took him, and heal him, and let him go; 14:5 and
answ them, saying, which of you shall have an ass or an ox fallen
into a pit, and will not straightway pull him out on the sabbath day?
14:6 and they could not answer him again to these things.

14:7 and he put forth a parabl to those which were bidden, when he
mark how they chose out the chief rooms; say unto them.

14:8 when thou art bidden of ani man to a wedding, sit not down in the
highest room; lest a more honour man than thou be bidden of him;
14:9 and he that bade thee and him come and say to thee, give thi man
place; and thou begin with shame to take the lowest room.
