14:10 but when thou art bidden, go and sit down in the lowest room;
that when he that bade thee cometh, he may say unto thee, friend, go
up higher: then shalt thou have worship in the presenc of them that
sit at meat with thee.

14:11 for whosoev exalteth himself shall be abased; and he that
humbleth himself shall be exalted.

14:12 then said he also to him that bade him, when thou makest a
dinn or a supper, call not thi friends, nor thi brethren, neither
thi kinsmen, nor thi rich neighbours; lest they also bid thee again,
and a recomp be made thee.

14:13 but when thou makest a feast, call the poor, the maimed, the
lame, the blind: 14:14 and thou shalt be blessed; for they cannot
recompens thee: for thou shalt be recompens at the resurrect of
th just.

14:15 and when one of them that sat at meat with him heard these
things, he said unto him, bless is he that shall eat bread in the
kingdom of god.

14:16 then said he unto him, A certain man made a great supper, and
bad many: 14:17 and sent hi servant at supper time to say to them
that were bidden, come; for all thing are now ready.

14:18 and they all with one consent began to make excuse. the first
said unto him, I have bought a piec of ground, and I must need go
and see it: I pray thee have me excused.

14:19 and anoth said, I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I go to
prov them: I pray thee have me excused.

14:20 and anoth said, I have marri a wife, and therefor I cannot
come.

14:21 So that servant came, and shew hi lord these things. then the
mast of the hous be angri said to hi servant, Go out quickly
into the street and lane of the city, and bring in hither the poor,
and the maimed, and the halt, and the blind.

14:22 and the servant said, lord, it is done as thou hast commanded,
and yet there is room.

14:23 and the lord said unto the servant, Go out into the highway and
hedges, and compel them to come in, that my hous may be filled.

14:24 for I say unto you, that none of those men which were bidden
shal tast of my supper.

14:25 and there went great multitud with him: and he turned, and
said unto them, 14:26 If ani man come to me, and hate not hi father,
and mother, and wife, and children, and brethren, and sisters, yea,
and hi own life also, he cannot be my disciple.

14:27 and whosoev doth not bear hi cross, and come after me, cannot
b my disciple.

14:28 for which of you, intend to build a tower, sitteth not down
first, and counteth the cost, whether he have suffici to finish it?
14:29 lest haply, after he hath laid the foundation, and is not able
to finish it, all that behold it begin to mock him, 14:30 saying, this
man began to build, and wa not abl to finish.

14:31 Or what king, go to make war against anoth king, sitteth
not down first, and consulteth whether he be abl with ten thousand to
meet him that cometh against him with twenti thousand?  14:32 Or else,
whil the other is yet a great way off, he sendeth an ambassage, and
desireth condit of peace.

14:33 So likewise, whosoev he be of you that forsaketh not all that
h hath, he cannot be my disciple.

14:34 salt is good: but if the salt have lost hi savour, wherewith
shal it be seasoned?  14:35 It is neither fit for the land, nor yet
for the dunghill; but men cast it out. He that hath ear to hear, let
him hear.

15:1 then drew near unto him all the publican and sinner for to hear
him.

15:2 and the pharise and scribe murmured, saying, thi man
receiveth sinners, and eateth with them.

15:3 and he spake thi parabl unto them, saying, 15:4 what man of
you, have an hundr sheep, if he lose one of them, doth not leave
th nineti and nine in the wilderness, and go after that which is
lost, until he find it?  15:5 and when he hath found it, he layeth it
on hi shoulders, rejoicing.

15:6 and when he cometh home, he calleth togeth hi friend and
neighbours, say unto them, rejoic with me; for I have found my
sheep which wa lost.

15:7 I say unto you, that likewis joy shall be in heaven over one
sinn that repenteth, more than over nineti and nine just persons,
which need no repentance.

15:8 either what woman have ten piec of silver, if she lose one
piece, doth not light a candle, and sweep the house, and seek
dilig till she find it?  15:9 and when she hath found it, she
calleth her friend and her neighbour together, saying, rejoic with
me; for I have found the piec which I had lost.

15:10 likewise, I say unto you, there is joy in the presenc of the
angel of god over one sinner that repenteth.

15:11 and he said, A certain man had two sons: 15:12 and the younger
of them said to hi father, father, give me the portion of good that
falleth to me. and he divid unto them hi living.

15:13 and not mani day after the younger son gather all together,
and took hi journey into a far country, and there wast his
subst with riotou living.

15:14 and when he had spent all, there aros a mighti famin in that
land; and he began to be in want.

15:15 and he went and join himself to a citizen of that country; and
h sent him into hi field to feed swine.

15:16 and he would fain have fill hi belli with the husk that the
swin did eat: and no man gave unto him.

15:17 and when he came to himself, he said, how mani hire servant of
mi father' have bread enough and to spare, and I perish with hunger!
15:18 I will aris and go to my father, and will say unto him, father,
i have sin against heaven, and befor thee, 15:19 and am no more
worthi to be call thi son: make me as one of thi hire servants.

15:20 and he arose, and came to hi father. but when he wa yet a
great way off, hi father saw him, and had compassion, and ran, and
fel on hi neck, and kiss him.

15:21 and the son said unto him, father, I have sin against heaven,
and in thi sight, and am no more worthi to be call thi son.

15:22 but the father said to hi servants, bring forth the best robe,
and put it on him; and put a ring on hi hand, and shoe on hi feet:
15:23 and bring hither the fat calf, and kill it; and let us eat,
and be merry: 15:24 for thi my son wa dead, and is aliv again; he
wa lost, and is found. and they began to be merry.

15:25 now hi elder son wa in the field: and as he came and drew nigh
to the house, he heard musick and dancing.

15:26 and he call one of the servants, and ask what these things
meant.

15:27 and he said unto him, thi brother is come; and thi father hath
kil the fat calf, becaus he hath receiv him safe and sound.

15:28 and he wa angry, and would not go in: therefor came hi father
out, and intreat him.

15:29 and he answer said to hi father, lo, these mani year do i
serv thee, neither transgress I at ani time thi commandment: and
yet thou never gavest me a kid, that I might make merri with my
friends: 15:30 but as soon as thi thi son wa come, which hath
devour thi live with harlots, thou hast kill for him the fatted
calf.

15:31 and he said unto him, son, thou art ever with me, and all that i
hav is thine.

15:32 It wa meet that we should make merry, and be glad: for thi thy
broth wa dead, and is aliv again; and wa lost, and is found.

16:1 and he said also unto hi disciples, there wa a certain rich
man, which had a steward; and the same wa accus unto him that he
had wast hi goods.

16:2 and he call him, and said unto him, how is it that I hear this
of thee? give an account of thi stewardship; for thou mayest be no
long steward.

16:3 then the steward said within himself, what shall I do? for my
lord taketh away from me the stewardship: I cannot dig; to beg I am
ashamed.

16:4 I am resolv what to do, that, when I am put out of the
stewardship, they may receiv me into their houses.

16:5 So he call everi one of hi lord' debtor unto him, and said
unto the first, how much owest thou unto my lord?  16:6 and he said,
an hundr measur of oil. and he said unto him, take thi bill, and
sit down quickly, and write fifty.

16:7 then said he to another, and how much owest thou? and he said, an
hundr measur of wheat. and he said unto him, take thi bill, and
writ fourscore.

16:8 and the lord commend the unjust steward, becaus he had done
wisely: for the children of thi world are in their gener wiser
than the children of light.

16:9 and I say unto you, make to yourselv friend of the mammon of
unrighteousness; that, when ye fail, they may receiv you into
everlast habitations.

16:10 He that is faith in that which is least is faith also in
much: and he that is unjust in the least is unjust also in much.

16:11 If therefor ye have not been faith in the unrighteous
mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?  16:12 and if
y have not been faith in that which is anoth man's, who shall
giv you that which is your own?  16:13 No servant can serv two
masters: for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else
h will hold to the one, and despis the other. Ye cannot serv god
and mammon.

16:14 and the pharise also, who were covetous, heard all these
things: and they derid him.

16:15 and he said unto them, Ye are they which justifi yourselves
befor men; but god knoweth your hearts: for that which is highly
esteem among men is abomin in the sight of god.

16:16 the law and the prophet were until john: sinc that time the
kingdom of god is preached, and everi man presseth into it.

16:17 and it is easier for heaven and earth to pass, than one tittle
of the law to fail.

16:18 whosoev putteth away hi wife, and marrieth another,
committeth adultery: and whosoev marrieth her that is put away from
her husband committeth adultery.

16:19 there wa a certain rich man, which wa cloth in purpl and
fin linen, and fare sumptuous everi day: 16:20 and there wa a
certain beggar name lazarus, which wa laid at hi gate, full of
sores, 16:21 and desir to be fed with the crumb which fell from
th rich man' table: moreov the dog came and lick hi sores.

16:22 and it came to pass, that the beggar died, and wa carri by
th angel into abraham' bosom: the rich man also died, and was
buried; 16:23 and in hell he lift up hi eyes, be in torments, and
seeth abraham afar off, and lazaru in hi bosom.

16:24 and he cri and said, father abraham, have merci on me, and
send lazarus, that he may dip the tip of hi finger in water, and cool
mi tongue; for I am torment in thi flame.

16:25 but abraham said, son, rememb that thou in thi lifetime
receivedst thi good things, and likewis lazaru evil things: but now
h is comforted, and thou art tormented.

16:26 and besid all this, between us and you there is a great gulf
fixed: so that they which would pass from henc to you cannot; neither
can they pass to us, that would come from thence.

16:27 then he said, I pray thee therefore, father, that thou wouldest
send him to my father' house: 16:28 for I have five brethren; that he
may testifi unto them, lest they also come into thi place of torment.

16:29 abraham saith unto him, they have mose and the prophets; let
them hear them.

16:30 and he said, nay, father abraham: but if one went unto them from
th dead, they will repent.

16:31 and he said unto him, If they hear not mose and the prophets,
neith will they be persuaded, though one rose from the dead.

17:1 then said he unto the disciples, It is imposs but that
off will come: but woe unto him, through whom they come!  17:2 it
wer better for him that a millston were hang about hi neck, and
h cast into the sea, than that he should offend one of these little
ones.

17:3 take heed to yourselves: If thi brother trespass against thee,
rebuk him; and if he repent, forgiv him.

17:4 and if he trespass against thee seven time in a day, and seven
tim in a day turn again to thee, saying, I repent; thou shalt
forg him.

17:5 and the apostl said unto the lord, increas our faith.

17:6 and the lord said, If ye had faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye
might say unto thi sycamin tree, Be thou pluck up by the root, and
b thou plant in the sea; and it should obey you.

17:7 but which of you, have a servant plow or feed cattle,
wil say unto him by and by, when he is come from the field, Go and
sit down to meat?  17:8 and will not rather say unto him, make ready
wherewith I may sup, and gird thyself, and serv me, till I have eaten
and drunken; and afterward thou shalt eat and drink?  17:9 doth he
thank that servant becaus he did the thing that were command him?
i trow not.

17:10 So likewis ye, when ye shall have done all those thing which
ar command you, say, We are unprofit servants: we have done
that which wa our duti to do.

17:11 and it came to pass, as he went to jerusalem, that he passed
through the midst of samaria and galilee.

17:12 and as he enter into a certain village, there met him ten men
that were lepers, which stood afar off: 17:13 and they lift up their
voices, and said, jesus, master, have merci on us.

17:14 and when he saw them, he said unto them, Go shew yourselv unto
th priests. and it came to pass, that, as they went, they were
cleansed.

17:15 and one of them, when he saw that he wa healed, turn back,
and with a loud voic glorifi god, 17:16 and fell down on hi face
at hi feet, give him thanks: and he wa a samaritan.

17:17 and jesu answer said, were there not ten cleansed? but where
ar the nine?  17:18 there are not found that return to give glory
to god, save thi stranger.

17:19 and he said unto him, arise, go thi way: thi faith hath made
the whole.

17:20 and when he wa demand of the pharisees, when the kingdom of
god should come, he answer them and said, the kingdom of god cometh
not with observation: 17:21 neither shall they say, Lo here! or, lo
there! for, behold, the kingdom of god is within you.

17:22 and he said unto the disciples, the day will come, when ye
shal desir to see one of the day of the son of man, and ye shall
not see it.

17:23 and they shall say to you, see here; or, see there: go not after
them, nor follow them.

17:24 for as the lightning, that lighteneth out of the one part under
heaven, shineth unto the other part under heaven; so shall also the
son of man be in hi day.

17:25 but first must he suffer mani things, and be reject of this
generation.

17:26 and as it wa in the day of noe, so shall it be also in the
day of the son of man.

17:27 they did eat, they drank, they marri wives, they were given in
marriage, until the day that noe enter into the ark, and the flood
came, and destroy them all.

17:28 likewis also as it wa in the day of lot; they did eat, they
drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they builded; 17:29 but
th same day that lot went out of sodom it rain fire and brimstone
from heaven, and destroy them all.

17:30 even thu shall it be in the day when the son of man is
revealed.

17:31 In that day, he which shall be upon the housetop, and hi stuff
in the house, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in
th field, let him likewis not return back.

17:32 rememb lot' wife.

17:33 whosoev shall seek to save hi life shall lose it; and
whosoev shall lose hi life shall preserv it.

17:34 I tell you, in that night there shall be two men in one bed; the
on shall be taken, and the other shall be left.

17:35 two women shall be grind together; the one shall be taken,
and the other left.

17:36 two men shall be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the
oth left.

17:37 and they answer and said unto him, where, lord? and he said
unto them, wheresoev the bodi is, thither will the eagl be
gath together.

18:1 and he spake a parabl unto them to thi end, that men ought
alway to pray, and not to faint; 18:2 saying, there wa in a citi a
judge, which fear not god, neither regard man: 18:3 and there was
a widow in that city; and she came unto him, saying, aveng me of mine
adversary.

18:4 and he would not for a while: but afterward he said within
himself, though I fear not god, nor regard man; 18:5 yet becaus this
widow troubleth me, I will aveng her, lest by her continu coming
sh weari me.

18:6 and the lord said, hear what the unjust judg saith.

18:7 and shall not god aveng hi own elect, which cri day and night
unto him, though he bear long with them?  18:8 I tell you that he will
aveng them speedily. nevertheless when the son of man cometh, shall
h find faith on the earth?  18:9 and he spake thi parabl unto
certain which trust in themselv that they were righteous, and
despis others: 18:10 two men went up into the templ to pray; the
on a pharisee, and the other a publican.

18:11 the pharise stood and pray thu with himself, god, I thank
thee, that I am not as other men are, extortioners, unjust,
adulterers, or even as thi publican.

18:12 I fast twice in the week, I give tith of all that I possess.

18:13 and the publican, stand afar off, would not lift up so much
a hi eye unto heaven, but smote upon hi breast, saying, god be
merci to me a sinner.

18:14 I tell you, thi man went down to hi hous justifi rather
than the other: for everi one that exalteth himself shall be abased;
and he that humbleth himself shall be exalted.

18:15 and they brought unto him also infants, that he would touch
them: but when hi discipl saw it, they rebuk them.

18:16 but jesu call them unto him, and said, suffer littl children
to come unto me, and forbid them not: for of such is the kingdom of
god.

18:17 verili I say unto you, whosoev shall not receiv the kingdom
of god as a littl child shall in no wise enter therein.

18:18 and a certain ruler ask him, saying, good master, what shall i
do to inherit etern life?  18:19 and jesu said unto him, why
callest thou me good? none is good, save one, that is, god.

18:20 thou knowest the commandments, Do not commit adultery, Do not
kill, Do not steal, Do not bear fals witness, honour thi father and
thi mother.

18:21 and he said, all these have I kept from my youth up.

18:22 now when jesu heard these things, he said unto him, yet lackest
th one thing: sell all that thou hast, and distribut unto the poor,
and thou shalt have treasur in heaven: and come, follow me.

18:23 and when he heard this, he wa veri sorrowful: for he wa very
rich.

18:24 and when jesu saw that he wa veri sorrowful, he said, how
hardli shall they that have rich enter into the kingdom of god!
18:25 for it is easier for a camel to go through a needle' eye, than
for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of god.

18:26 and they that heard it said, who then can be saved?  18:27 and
h said, the thing which are imposs with men are possibl with
god.

18:28 then peter said, lo, we have left all, and follow thee.

18:29 and he said unto them, verili I say unto you, there is no man
that hath left house, or parents, or brethren, or wife, or children,
for the kingdom of god' sake, 18:30 who shall not receiv manifold
mor in thi present time, and in the world to come life everlasting.

18:31 then he took unto him the twelve, and said unto them, behold, we
go up to jerusalem, and all thing that are written by the prophets
concern the son of man shall be accomplished.

18:32 for he shall be deliv unto the gentiles, and shall be
mocked, and spite entreated, and spit on: 18:33 and they shall
scourg him, and put him to death: and the third day he shall rise
again.

18:34 and they understood none of these things: and thi say was
hid from them, neither knew they the thing which were spoken.

18:35 and it came to pass, that as he wa come nigh unto jericho, a
certain blind man sat by the way side begging: 18:36 and hear the
multitud pass by, he ask what it meant.

18:37 and they told him, that jesu of nazareth passeth by.

18:38 and he cried, saying, jesus, thou son of david, have merci on
me.

18:39 and they which went befor rebuk him, that he should hold his
peace: but he cri so much the more, thou son of david, have merci on
me.

18:40 and jesu stood, and command him to be brought unto him: and
when he wa come near, he ask him, 18:41 saying, what wilt thou that
i shall do unto thee? and he said, lord, that I may receiv my sight.

18:42 and jesu said unto him, receiv thi sight: thi faith hath saved
thee.

18:43 and immedi he receiv hi sight, and follow him,
glorifi god: and all the people, when they saw it, gave prais unto
god.

19:1 and jesu enter and pass through jericho.

19:2 and, behold, there wa a man name zacchaeus, which wa the chief
among the publicans, and he wa rich.

19:3 and he sought to see jesu who he was; and could not for the
press, becaus he wa littl of stature.

19:4 and he ran before, and climb up into a sycomor tree to see
him: for he wa to pass that way.

19:5 and when jesu came to the place, he look up, and saw him, and
said unto him, zacchaeus, make haste, and come down; for to day I must
abid at thi house.

19:6 and he made haste, and came down, and receiv him joyfully.

19:7 and when they saw it, they all murmured, saying, that he wa gone
to be guest with a man that is a sinner.

19:8 and zacchaeu stood, and said unto the lord: behold, lord, the
half of my good I give to the poor; and if I have taken ani thing
from ani man by fals accusation, I restor him fourfold.

19:9 and jesu said unto him, thi day is salvat come to this
house, forsomuch as he also is a son of abraham.

19:10 for the son of man is come to seek and to save that which was
lost.

19:11 and as they heard these things, he ad and spake a parable,
becaus he wa nigh to jerusalem, and becaus they thought that the
kingdom of god should immedi appear.

19:12 He said therefore, A certain nobleman went into a far countri to
rec for himself a kingdom, and to return.

19:13 and he call hi ten servants, and deliv them ten pounds,
and said unto them, occupi till I come.

19:14 but hi citizen hate him, and sent a messag after him,
saying, We will not have thi man to reign over us.

19:15 and it came to pass, that when he wa returned, have received
th kingdom, then he command these servant to be call unto him,
to whom he had given the money, that he might know how much everi man
had gain by trading.

19:16 then came the first, saying, lord, thi pound hath gain ten
pounds.

19:17 and he said unto him, well, thou good servant: becaus thou hast
been faith in a veri little, have thou author over ten cities.

19:18 and the second came, saying, lord, thi pound hath gain five
pounds.

19:19 and he said likewis to him, Be thou also over five cities.

19:20 and anoth came, saying, lord, behold, here is thi pound, which
i have kept laid up in a napkin: 19:21 for I fear thee, becaus thou
art an auster man: thou takest up that thou layedst not down, and
reapest that thou didst not sow.

19:22 and he saith unto him, out of thine own mouth will I judg thee,
thou wick servant. thou knewest that I wa an auster man, take up
that I laid not down, and reap that I did not sow: 19:23 wherefore
then gavest not thou my money into the bank, that at my come I might
hav requir mine own with usury?  19:24 and he said unto them that
stood by, take from him the pound, and give it to him that hath ten
pounds.

19:25 (and they said unto him, lord, he hath ten pounds.)  19:26 for i
say unto you, that unto everi one which hath shall be given; and from
him that hath not, even that he hath shall be taken away from him.

19:27 but those mine enemies, which would not that I should reign over
them, bring hither, and slay them befor me.

19:28 and when he had thu spoken, he went before, ascend up to
jerusalem.

19:29 and it came to pass, when he wa come nigh to bethphag and
bethany, at the mount call the mount of olives, he sent two of his
disciples, 19:30 saying, Go ye into the villag over against you; in
th which at your enter ye shall find a colt tied, whereon yet
nev man sat: loos him, and bring him hither.

19:31 and if ani man ask you, whi do ye loos him? thu shall ye say
unto him, becaus the lord hath need of him.

19:32 and they that were sent went their way, and found even as he had
said unto them.

19:33 and as they were loos the colt, the owner thereof said unto
them, whi loos ye the colt?  19:34 and they said, the lord hath need
of him.

19:35 and they brought him to jesus: and they cast their garment upon
th colt, and they set jesu thereon.

19:36 and as he went, they spread their cloth in the way.

19:37 and when he wa come nigh, even now at the descent of the mount
of olives, the whole multitud of the discipl began to rejoic and
prais god with a loud voic for all the mighti work that they had
seen; 19:38 saying, bless be the king that cometh in the name of the
lord: peac in heaven, and glori in the highest.

19:39 and some of the pharise from among the multitud said unto
him, master, rebuk thi disciples.

19:40 and he answer and said unto them, I tell you that, if these
should hold their peace, the stone would immedi cri out.

19:41 and when he wa come near, he beheld the city, and wept over it,
19:42 saying, If thou hadst known, even thou, at least in thi thy
day, the thing which belong unto thi peace! but now they are hid from
thin eyes.

19:43 for the day shall come upon thee, that thine enemi shall cast
a trench about thee, and compass thee round, and keep thee in on every
side, 19:44 and shall lay thee even with the ground, and thi children
within thee; and they shall not leav in thee one stone upon another;
becaus thou knewest not the time of thi visitation.

19:45 and he went into the temple, and began to cast out them that
sold therein, and them that bought; 19:46 say unto them, It is
written, My hous is the hous of prayer: but ye have made it a den of
thieves.

19:47 and he taught daili in the temple. but the chief priest and the
scrib and the chief of the peopl sought to destroy him, 19:48 and
could not find what they might do: for all the peopl were very
attent to hear him.

20:1 and it came to pass, that on one of those days, as he taught the
peopl in the temple, and preach the gospel, the chief priest and
th scribe came upon him with the elders, 20:2 and spake unto him,
saying, tell us, by what author doest thou these things? or who is
h that gave thee thi authority?  20:3 and he answer and said unto
them, I will also ask you one thing; and answer me: 20:4 the baptism
of john, wa it from heaven, or of men?  20:5 and they reason with
themselves, saying, If we shall say, from heaven; he will say, why
then believ ye him not?  20:6 but and if we say, Of men; all the
peopl will stone us: for they be persuad that john wa a prophet.

20:7 and they answered, that they could not tell whenc it was.

20:8 and jesu said unto them, neither tell I you by what author i
do these things.

20:9 then began he to speak to the peopl thi parable; A certain man
plant a vineyard, and let it forth to husbandmen, and went into a
far countri for a long time.

20:10 and at the season he sent a servant to the husbandmen, that they
should give him of the fruit of the vineyard: but the husbandmen beat
him, and sent him away empty.

20:11 and again he sent anoth servant: and they beat him also, and
entr him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

20:12 and again he sent a third: and they wound him also, and cast
him out.

20:13 then said the lord of the vineyard, what shall I do? I will send
mi belov son: it may be they will rever him when they see him.

20:14 but when the husbandmen saw him, they reason among themselves,
saying, thi is the heir: come, let us kill him, that the inheritance
may be ours.

20:15 So they cast him out of the vineyard, and kill him. what
therefor shall the lord of the vineyard do unto them?  20:16 He shall
com and destroy these husbandmen, and shall give the vineyard to
others. and when they heard it, they said, god forbid.

20:17 and he beheld them, and said, what is thi then that is written,
th stone which the builder rejected, the same is becom the head of
th corner?  20:18 whosoev shall fall upon that stone shall be
broken; but on whomsoev it shall fall, it will grind him to powder.

20:19 and the chief priest and the scribe the same hour sought to
lay hand on him; and they fear the people: for they perceiv that
h had spoken thi parabl against them.

20:20 and they watch him, and sent forth spies, which should feign
themselv just men, that they might take hold of hi words, that so
they might deliv him unto the power and author of the governor.

20:21 and they ask him, saying, master, we know that thou sayest and
teachest rightly, neither acceptest thou the person of any, but
teachest the way of god truly: 20:22 Is it law for us to give
tribut unto caesar, or no?  20:23 but he perceiv their craftiness,
and said unto them, whi tempt ye me?  20:24 shew me a penny. whose
imag and superscript hath it? they answer and said, caesar's.

20:25 and he said unto them, render therefor unto caesar the things
which be caesar's, and unto god the thing which be god's.

20:26 and they could not take hold of hi word befor the people: and
they marvel at hi answer, and held their peace.

20:27 then came to him certain of the sadducees, which deni that there
i ani resurrection; and they ask him, 20:28 saying, master, moses
wrot unto us, If ani man' brother die, have a wife, and he die
without children, that hi brother should take hi wife, and rais up
se unto hi brother.

20:29 there were therefor seven brethren: and the first took a wife,
and die without children.

20:30 and the second took her to wife, and he die childless.

20:31 and the third took her; and in like manner the seven also: and
they left no children, and died.

20:32 last of all the woman die also.

20:33 therefor in the resurrect whose wife of them is she? for
seven had her to wife.

20:34 and jesu answer said unto them, the children of thi world
marry, and are given in marriage: 20:35 but they which shall be
account worthi to obtain that world, and the resurrect from the
dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage: 20:36 neither can they
di ani more: for they are equal unto the angels; and are the children
of god, be the children of the resurrection.

20:37 now that the dead are raised, even mose shew at the bush,
when he calleth the lord the god of abraham, and the god of isaac, and
th god of jacob.

20:38 for he is not a god of the dead, but of the living: for all live
unto him.

20:39 then certain of the scribe answer said, master, thou hast
wel said.

20:40 and after that they durst not ask him ani question at all.

20:41 and he said unto them, how say they that christ is david' son?
20:42 and david himself saith in the book of psalms, the lord said
unto my lord, sit thou on my right hand, 20:43 till I make thine
enemi thi footstool.

20:44 david therefor calleth him lord, how is he then hi son?  20:45
then in the audienc of all the peopl he said unto hi disciples,
20:46 bewar of the scribes, which desir to walk in long robes, and
lov greet in the markets, and the highest seat in the
synagogues, and the chief room at feasts; 20:47 which devour widows'
houses, and for a shew make long prayers: the same shall receive
great damnation.

21:1 and he look up, and saw the rich men cast their gift into
th treasury.

21:2 and he saw also a certain poor widow cast in thither two
mites.

21:3 and he said, Of a truth I say unto you, that thi poor widow hath
cast in more than they all: 21:4 for all these have of their abundance
cast in unto the offer of god: but she of her penuri hath cast in
al the live that she had.

21:5 and as some spake of the temple, how it wa adorn with goodly
ston and gifts, he said, 21:6 As for these thing which ye behold,
th day will come, in the which there shall not be left one stone
upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

21:7 and they ask him, saying, master, but when shall these things
be?  and what sign will there be when these thing shall come to pass?
21:8 and he said, take heed that ye be not deceived: for mani shall
com in my name, saying, I am christ; and the time draweth near: go ye
not therefor after them.

21:9 but when ye shall hear of war and commotions, be not terrified:
for these thing must first come to pass; but the end is not by and
by.

21:10 then said he unto them, nation shall rise against nation, and
kingdom against kingdom: 21:11 and great earthquak shall be in
div places, and famines, and pestilences; and fear sight and
great sign shall there be from heaven.

21:12 but befor all these, they shall lay their hand on you, and
persecut you, deliv you up to the synagogues, and into prisons,
b brought befor king and ruler for my name' sake.

21:13 and it shall turn to you for a testimony.

21:14 settl it therefor in your hearts, not to medit befor what
y shall answer: 21:15 for I will give you a mouth and wisdom, which
al your adversari shall not be abl to gainsay nor resist.

21:16 and ye shall be betray both by parents, and brethren, and
kinsfolks, and friends; and some of you shall they caus to be put to
death.

21:17 and ye shall be hate of all men for my name' sake.

21:18 but there shall not an hair of your head perish.

21:19 In your patienc possess ye your souls.

21:20 and when ye shall see jerusalem compass with armies, then know
that the desol thereof is nigh.

21:21 then let them which are in judaea flee to the mountains; and let
them which are in the midst of it depart out; and let not them that
ar in the countri enter thereinto.

21:22 for these be the day of vengeance, that all thing which are
written may be fulfilled.

21:23 but woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give
suck, in those days! for there shall be great distress in the land,
and wrath upon thi people.

21:24 and they shall fall by the edg of the sword, and shall be led
away captiv into all nations: and jerusalem shall be trodden down of
th gentiles, until the time of the gentil be fulfilled.

21:25 and there shall be sign in the sun, and in the moon, and in the
stars; and upon the earth distress of nations, with perplexity; the
sea and the wave roaring; 21:26 men' heart fail them for fear,
and for look after those thing which are come on the earth: for
th power of heaven shall be shaken.

21:27 and then shall they see the son of man come in a cloud with
pow and great glory.

21:28 and when these thing begin to come to pass, then look up, and
lift up your heads; for your redempt draweth nigh.

21:29 and he spake to them a parable; behold the fig tree, and all the
trees; 21:30 when they now shoot forth, ye see and know of your own
selv that summer is now nigh at hand.

21:31 So likewis ye, when ye see these thing come to pass, know ye
that the kingdom of god is nigh at hand.

21:32 verili I say unto you, thi gener shall not pass away, till
al be fulfilled.

21:33 heaven and earth shall pass away: but my word shall not pass
away.

21:34 and take heed to yourselves, lest at ani time your heart be
overcharg with surfeiting, and drunkenness, and care of thi life,
and so that day come upon you unawares.

21:35 for as a snare shall it come on all them that dwell on the face
of the whole earth.

21:36 watch ye therefore, and pray always, that ye may be accounted
worthi to escap all these thing that shall come to pass, and to
stand befor the son of man.

21:37 and in the day time he wa teach in the temple; and at night
h went out, and abod in the mount that is call the mount of
olives.

21:38 and all the peopl came earli in the morn to him in the
temple, for to hear him.

22:1 now the feast of unleaven bread drew nigh, which is call the
passover.

22:2 and the chief priest and scribe sought how they might kill him;
for they fear the people.

22:3 then enter satan into juda surnam iscariot, be of the
numb of the twelve.

22:4 and he went hi way, and commun with the chief priest and
captains, how he might betray him unto them.

22:5 and they were glad, and coven to give him money.

22:6 and he promised, and sought opportun to betray him unto them
in the absenc of the multitude.

22:7 then came the day of unleaven bread, when the passov must be
killed.

22:8 and he sent peter and john, saying, Go and prepar us the
passover, that we may eat.

22:9 and they said unto him, where wilt thou that we prepare?  22:10
and he said unto them, behold, when ye are enter into the city,
ther shall a man meet you, bear a pitcher of water; follow him
into the hous where he entereth in.

22:11 and ye shall say unto the goodman of the house, the master saith
unto thee, where is the guestchamber, where I shall eat the passover
with my disciples?  22:12 and he shall shew you a larg upper room
furnished: there make ready.

22:13 and they went, and found as he had said unto them: and they made
readi the passover.

22:14 and when the hour wa come, he sat down, and the twelv apostles
with him.

22:15 and he said unto them, with desir I have desir to eat this
passov with you befor I suffer: 22:16 for I say unto you, I will
not ani more eat thereof, until it be fulfil in the kingdom of god.

22:17 and he took the cup, and gave thanks, and said, take this, and
divid it among yourselves: 22:18 for I say unto you, I will not drink
of the fruit of the vine, until the kingdom of god shall come.

22:19 and he took bread, and gave thanks, and brake it, and gave unto
them, saying, thi is my bodi which is given for you: thi do in
remembr of me.

22:20 likewis also the cup after supper, saying, thi cup is the new
testa in my blood, which is shed for you.

22:21 but, behold, the hand of him that betrayeth me is with me on the
table.

22:22 and truli the son of man goeth, as it wa determined: but woe
unto that man by whom he is betrayed!  22:23 and they began to enquire
among themselves, which of them it wa that should do thi thing.

22:24 and there wa also a strife among them, which of them should be
account the greatest.

22:25 and he said unto them, the king of the gentil exercise
lordship over them; and they that exercis author upon them are
cal benefactors.

22:26 but ye shall not be so: but he that is greatest among you, let
him be as the younger; and he that is chief, as he that doth serve.

22:27 for whether is greater, he that sitteth at meat, or he that
serveth?  is not he that sitteth at meat? but I am among you as he
that serveth.

22:28 Ye are they which have continu with me in my temptations.

22:29 and I appoint unto you a kingdom, as my father hath appointed
unto me; 22:30 that ye may eat and drink at my tabl in my kingdom,
and sit on throne judg the twelv tribe of israel.

22:31 and the lord said, simon, simon, behold, satan hath desir to
hav you, that he may sift you as wheat: 22:32 but I have pray for
thee, that thi faith fail not: and when thou art converted, strengthen
thi brethren.

22:33 and he said unto him, lord, I am readi to go with thee, both
into prison, and to death.

22:34 and he said, I tell thee, peter, the cock shall not crow this
day, befor that thou shalt thrice deni that thou knowest me.

22:35 and he said unto them, when I sent you without purse, and scrip,
and shoes, lack ye ani thing? and they said, nothing.

22:36 then said he unto them, but now, he that hath a purse, let him
tak it, and likewis hi scrip: and he that hath no sword, let him
sel hi garment, and buy one.

22:37 for I say unto you, that thi that is written must yet be
accomplish in me, and he wa reckon among the transgressors: for
th thing concern me have an end.

22:38 and they said, lord, behold, here are two swords. and he said
unto them, It is enough.

22:39 and he came out, and went, as he wa wont, to the mount of
olives; and hi discipl also follow him.

22:40 and when he wa at the place, he said unto them, pray that ye
ent not into temptation.

22:41 and he wa withdrawn from them about a stone' cast, and kneeled
down, and prayed, 22:42 saying, father, if thou be willing, remove
thi cup from me: nevertheless not my will, but thine, be done.

22:43 and there appear an angel unto him from heaven, strengthening
him.

22:44 and be in an agoni he pray more earnestly: and hi sweat
wa as it were great drop of blood fall down to the ground.

22:45 and when he rose up from prayer, and wa come to hi disciples,
h found them sleep for sorrow, 22:46 and said unto them, whi sleep
ye? rise and pray, lest ye enter into temptation.

22:47 and while he yet spake, behold a multitude, and he that was
cal judas, one of the twelve, went befor them, and drew near unto
jesu to kiss him.

22:48 but jesu said unto him, judas, betrayest thou the son of man
with a kiss?  22:49 when they which were about him saw what would
follow, they said unto him, lord, shall we smite with the sword?
22:50 and one of them smote the servant of the high priest, and cut
off hi right ear.

22:51 and jesu answer and said, suffer ye thu far. and he touched
hi ear, and heal him.

22:52 then jesu said unto the chief priests, and captain of the
temple, and the elders, which were come to him, Be ye come out, as
against a thief, with sword and staves?  22:53 when I wa daili with
you in the temple, ye stretch forth no hand against me: but thi is
your hour, and the power of darkness.

22:54 then took they him, and led him, and brought him into the high
priest' house. and peter follow afar off.

22:55 and when they had kindl a fire in the midst of the hall, and
wer set down together, peter sat down among them.

22:56 but a certain maid beheld him as he sat by the fire, and
earnestli look upon him, and said, thi man wa also with him.

22:57 and he deni him, saying, woman, I know him not.

22:58 and after a littl while anoth saw him, and said, thou art
also of them. and peter said, man, I am not.

22:59 and about the space of one hour after anoth confidently
affirmed, saying, Of a truth thi fellow also wa with him: for he is
a galilaean.

22:60 and peter said, man, I know not what thou sayest. and
immediately, while he yet spake, the cock crew.

22:61 and the lord turned, and look upon peter. and peter remembered
th word of the lord, how he had said unto him, befor the cock crow,
thou shalt deni me thrice.

22:62 and peter went out, and wept bitterly.

22:63 and the men that held jesu mock him, and smote him.

22:64 and when they had blindfold him, they struck him on the face,
and ask him, saying, prophesy, who is it that smote thee?  22:65 and
mani other thing blasphem spake they against him.

22:66 and as soon as it wa day, the elder of the peopl and the
chief priest and the scribe came together, and led him into their
council, saying, 22:67 art thou the christ? tell us. and he said unto
them, If I tell you, ye will not believe: 22:68 and if I also ask you,
y will not answer me, nor let me go.

22:69 hereaft shall the son of man sit on the right hand of the
pow of god.

22:70 then said they all, art thou then the son of god? and he said
unto them, Ye say that I am.

22:71 and they said, what need we ani further witness? for we
ourselv have heard of hi own mouth.

23:1 and the whole multitud of them arose, and led him unto pilate.

23:2 and they began to accus him, saying, We found thi fellow
pervert the nation, and forbid to give tribut to caesar,
say that he himself is christ a king.

23:3 and pilat ask him, saying, art thou the king of the jews? and
h answer him and said, thou sayest it.

23:4 then said pilat to the chief priest and to the people, I find
no fault in thi man.

23:5 and they were the more fierce, saying, He stirreth up the people,
teach throughout all jewry, begin from galile to thi place.

23:6 when pilat heard of galilee, he ask whether the man were a
galilaean.

23:7 and as soon as he knew that he belong unto herod's
jurisdiction, he sent him to herod, who himself also wa at jerusalem
at that time.

23:8 and when herod saw jesus, he wa exceed glad: for he was
desir to see him of a long season, becaus he had heard mani things
of him; and he hope to have seen some miracl done by him.

23:9 then he question with him in mani words; but he answer him
nothing.

23:10 and the chief priest and scribe stood and vehement accused
him.

23:11 and herod with hi men of war set him at nought, and mock him,
and array him in a gorgeou robe, and sent him again to pilate.

23:12 and the same day pilat and herod were made friend together:
for befor they were at enmiti between themselves.

23:13 and pilate, when he had call togeth the chief priest and
th ruler and the people, 23:14 said unto them, Ye have brought this
man unto me, as one that perverteth the people: and, behold, I, having
examin him befor you, have found no fault in thi man touching
thos thing whereof ye accus him: 23:15 no, nor yet herod: for i
sent you to him; and, lo, noth worthi of death is done unto him.

23:16 I will therefor chastis him, and releas him.

23:17 (for of necess he must releas one unto them at the feast.)
23:18 and they cri out all at once, saying, away with thi man, and
releas unto us barabbas: 23:19 (who for a certain sedit made in
th city, and for murder, wa cast into prison.)  23:20 pilate
therefore, will to releas jesus, spake again to them.

23:21 but they cried, saying, crucifi him, crucifi him.

23:22 and he said unto them the third time, why, what evil hath he
done? I have found no caus of death in him: I will therefor chastise
him, and let him go.

23:23 and they were instant with loud voices, requir that he might
b crucified. and the voic of them and of the chief priests
prevailed.

23:24 and pilat gave sentenc that it should be as they required.

23:25 and he releas unto them him that for sedit and murder was
cast into prison, whom they had desired; but he deliv jesu to
their will.

23:26 and as they led him away, they laid hold upon one simon, a
cyrenian, come out of the country, and on him they laid the cross,
that he might bear it after jesus.

23:27 and there follow him a great compani of people, and of women,
which also bewail and lament him.

23:28 but jesu turn unto them said, daughter of jerusalem, weep
not for me, but weep for yourselves, and for your children.

23:29 for, behold, the day are coming, in the which they shall say,
bless are the barren, and the womb that never bare, and the paps
which never gave suck.

23:30 then shall they begin to say to the mountains, fall on us; and
to the hills, cover us.

23:31 for if they do these thing in a green tree, what shall be done
in the dry?  23:32 and there were also two other, malefactors, led
with him to be put to death.

23:33 and when they were come to the place, which is call calvary,
ther they crucifi him, and the malefactors, one on the right hand,
and the other on the left.

23:34 then said jesus, father, forgiv them; for they know not what
they do. and they part hi raiment, and cast lots.

23:35 and the peopl stood beholding. and the ruler also with them
derid him, saying, He save others; let him save himself, if he be
christ, the chosen of god.

23:36 and the soldier also mock him, come to him, and offering
him vinegar, 23:37 and saying, If thou be the king of the jews, save
thyself.

23:38 and a superscript also wa written over him in letter of
greek, and latin, and hebrew, thi IS the king OF the jews.

23:39 and one of the malefactor which were hang rail on him,
saying, If thou be christ, save thyself and us.

23:40 but the other answer rebuk him, saying, dost not thou fear
god, see thou art in the same condemnation?  23:41 and we indeed
justly; for we receiv the due reward of our deeds: but thi man hath
don noth amiss.

23:42 and he said unto jesus, lord, rememb me when thou comest into
thi kingdom.

23:43 and jesu said unto him, verili I say unto thee, To day shalt
thou be with me in paradise.

23:44 and it wa about the sixth hour, and there wa a dark over
al the earth until the ninth hour.

23:45 and the sun wa darkened, and the veil of the templ wa rent in
th midst.

23:46 and when jesu had cri with a loud voice, he said, father,
into thi hand I commend my spirit: and have said thus, he gave up
th ghost.

23:47 now when the centurion saw what wa done, he glorifi god,
saying, certainli thi wa a righteou man.

23:48 and all the peopl that came togeth to that sight, beholding
th thing which were done, smote their breasts, and returned.

23:49 and all hi acquaintance, and the women that follow him from
galilee, stood afar off, behold these things.

23:50 and, behold, there wa a man name joseph, a counsellor; and he
wa a good man, and a just: 23:51 (the same had not consent to the
counsel and deed of them;) he wa of arimathaea, a citi of the jews:
who also himself wait for the kingdom of god.

23:52 thi man went unto pilate, and beg the bodi of jesus.

23:53 and he took it down, and wrap it in linen, and laid it in a
sepulchr that wa hewn in stone, wherein never man befor wa laid.

23:54 and that day wa the preparation, and the sabbath drew on.

23:55 and the women also, which came with him from galilee, followed
after, and beheld the sepulchre, and how hi bodi wa laid.

23:56 and they returned, and prepar spice and ointments; and rested
th sabbath day accord to the commandment.

24:1 now upon the first day of the week, veri earli in the morning,
they came unto the sepulchre, bring the spice which they had
prepared, and certain other with them.

24:2 and they found the stone roll away from the sepulchre.

24:3 and they enter in, and found not the bodi of the lord jesus.

24:4 and it came to pass, as they were much perplex thereabout,
behold, two men stood by them in shine garments: 24:5 and as they
wer afraid, and bow down their face to the earth, they said unto
them, whi seek ye the live among the dead?  24:6 He is not here, but
i risen: rememb how he spake unto you when he wa yet in galilee,
24:7 saying, the son of man must be deliv into the hand of sinful
men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.

24:8 and they rememb hi words, 24:9 and return from the
sepulchre, and told all these thing unto the eleven, and to all the
rest.

24:10 It wa mari magdalen and joanna, and mari the mother of james,
and other women that were with them, which told these thing unto the
apostles.

24:11 and their word seem to them as idl tales, and they believed
them not.

24:12 then aros peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stoop down,
h beheld the linen cloth laid by themselves, and departed,
wond in himself at that which wa come to pass.

24:13 and, behold, two of them went that same day to a villag called
emmaus, which wa from jerusalem about threescor furlongs.

24:14 and they talk togeth of all these thing which had happened.

24:15 and it came to pass, that, while they commun togeth and
reasoned, jesu himself drew near, and went with them.

24:16 but their eye were holden that they should not know him.

24:17 and he said unto them, what manner of commun are these
that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?  24:18 and the
on of them, whose name wa cleopas, answer said unto him, art thou
onli a stranger in jerusalem, and hast not known the thing which are
com to pass there in these days?  24:19 and he said unto them, what
things? and they said unto him, concern jesu of nazareth, which
wa a prophet mighti in deed and word befor god and all the people:
24:20 and how the chief priest and our ruler deliv him to be
condemn to death, and have crucifi him.

24:21 but we trust that it had been he which should have redeemed
israel: and besid all this, to day is the third day sinc these
th were done.

24:22 yea, and certain women also of our compani made us astonished,
which were earli at the sepulchre; 24:23 and when they found not his
body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels,
which said that he wa alive.

24:24 and certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre,
and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.

24:25 then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe
al that the prophet have spoken: 24:26 ought not christ to have
suff these things, and to enter into hi glory?  24:27 and
begin at mose and all the prophets, he expound unto them in all
th scriptur the thing concern himself.

24:28 and they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he
mad as though he would have gone further.

24:29 but they constrain him, saying, abid with us: for it is
toward evening, and the day is far spent. and he went in to tarri with
them.

24:30 and it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread,
and bless it, and brake, and gave to them.

24:31 and their eye were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished
out of their sight.

24:32 and they said one to another, did not our heart burn within us,
whil he talk with us by the way, and while he open to us the
scriptures?  24:33 and they rose up the same hour, and return to
jerusalem, and found the eleven gather together, and them that were
with them, 24:34 saying, the lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared
to simon.

24:35 and they told what thing were done in the way, and how he was
known of them in break of bread.

24:36 and as they thu spake, jesu himself stood in the midst of
them, and saith unto them, peac be unto you.

24:37 but they were terrifi and affrighted, and suppos that they
had seen a spirit.

24:38 and he said unto them, whi are ye troubled? and whi do thoughts
aris in your hearts?  24:39 behold my hand and my feet, that it is i
myself: handl me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as
y see me have.

24:40 and when he had thu spoken, he shew them hi hand and his
feet.

24:41 and while they yet believ not for joy, and wondered, he said
unto them, have ye here ani meat?  24:42 and they gave him a piec of
a broil fish, and of an honeycomb.

24:43 and he took it, and did eat befor them.

24:44 and he said unto them, these are the word which I spake unto
you, while I wa yet with you, that all thing must be fulfilled,
which were written in the law of moses, and in the prophets, and in
th psalms, concern me.

24:45 then open he their understanding, that they might understand
th scriptures, 24:46 and said unto them, thu it is written, and thus
it behov christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:
24:47 and that repent and remiss of sin should be preach in
hi name among all nations, begin at jerusalem.

24:48 and ye are wit of these things.

24:49 and, behold, I send the promis of my father upon you: but tarry
y in the citi of jerusalem, until ye be endu with power from on
high.

24:50 and he led them out as far as to bethany, and he lift up his
hands, and bless them.

24:51 and it came to pass, while he bless them, he wa part from
them, and carri up into heaven.

24:52 and they worship him, and return to jerusalem with great
joy: 24:53 and were continu in the temple, prais and blessing
god. amen.




th gospel accord to saint john


1:1 In the begin wa the word, and the word wa with god, and the
word wa god.

1:2 the same wa in the begin with god.

1:3 all thing were made by him; and without him wa not ani thing
mad that wa made.

1:4 In him wa life; and the life wa the light of men.

1:5 and the light shineth in darkness; and the dark comprehended
it not.

1:6 there wa a man sent from god, whose name wa john.

1:7 the same came for a witness, to bear wit of the light, that
al men through him might believe.

1:8 He wa not that light, but wa sent to bear wit of that light.

1:9 that wa the true light, which lighteth everi man that cometh into
th world.

1:10 He wa in the world, and the world wa made by him, and the world
knew him not.

1:11 He came unto hi own, and hi own receiv him not.

1:12 but as mani as receiv him, to them gave he power to becom the
son of god, even to them that believ on hi name: 1:13 which were
born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of
man, but of god.

1:14 and the word wa made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld
hi glory, the glori as of the onli begotten of the father,) full of
grac and truth.

1:15 john bare wit of him, and cried, saying, thi wa he of whom
i spake, He that cometh after me is prefer befor me: for he was
befor me.

1:16 and of hi ful have all we received, and grace for grace.

1:17 for the law wa given by moses, but grace and truth came by jesus
christ.

1:18 No man hath seen god at ani time, the onli begotten son, which is
in the bosom of the father, he hath declar him.

1:19 and thi is the record of john, when the jew sent priest and
levit from jerusalem to ask him, who art thou?  1:20 and he
confessed, and deni not; but confessed, I am not the christ.

1:21 and they ask him, what then? art thou elias? and he saith, I am
not. art thou that prophet? and he answered, no.

1:22 then said they unto him, who art thou? that we may give an answer
to them that sent us. what sayest thou of thyself?  1:23 He said, I am
th voic of one cri in the wilderness, make straight the way of
th lord, as said the prophet esaias.

1:24 and they which were sent were of the pharisees.

1:25 and they ask him, and said unto him, whi baptizest thou then,
if thou be not that christ, nor elias, neither that prophet?  1:26
john answer them, saying, I baptiz with water: but there standeth
on among you, whom ye know not; 1:27 He it is, who come after me is
pref befor me, whose shoe' latchet I am not worthi to unloose.

1:28 these thing were done in bethabara beyond jordan, where john was
baptizing.

1:29 the next day john seeth jesu come unto him, and saith, behold
th lamb of god, which taketh away the sin of the world.

1:30 thi is he of whom I said, after me cometh a man which is
pref befor me: for he wa befor me.

1:31 and I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to
israel, therefor am I come baptiz with water.

1:32 and john bare record, saying, I saw the spirit descend from
heaven like a dove, and it abod upon him.

1:33 and I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptiz with water,
th same said unto me, upon whom thou shalt see the spirit descending,
and remain on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the holy
ghost.

1:34 and I saw, and bare record that thi is the son of god.

1:35 again the next day after john stood, and two of hi disciples;
1:36 and look upon jesu as he walked, he saith, behold the lamb of
god!  1:37 and the two discipl heard him speak, and they followed
jesus.

1:38 then jesu turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them,
what seek ye? they said unto him, rabbi, (which is to say, being
interpreted, master,) where dwellest thou?  1:39 He saith unto them,
com and see. they came and saw where he dwelt, and abod with him
that day: for it wa about the tenth hour.

1:40 one of the two which heard john speak, and follow him, was
andrew, simon peter' brother.

1:41 He first findeth hi own brother simon, and saith unto him, we
hav found the messias, which is, be interpreted, the christ.

1:42 and he brought him to jesus. and when jesu beheld him, he said,
thou art simon the son of jona: thou shalt be call cephas, which is
bi interpretation, A stone.

1:43 the day follow jesu would go forth into galilee, and findeth
philip, and saith unto him, follow me.

1:44 now philip wa of bethsaida, the citi of andrew and peter.

1:45 philip findeth nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him,
of whom mose in the law, and the prophets, did write, jesu of
nazareth, the son of joseph.

1:46 and nathanael said unto him, can there ani good thing come out of
nazareth? philip saith unto him, come and see.

1:47 jesu saw nathanael come to him, and saith of him, behold an
israelit indeed, in whom is no guile!  1:48 nathanael saith unto him,
whenc knowest thou me? jesu answer and said unto him, befor that
philip call thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.

1:49 nathanael answer and saith unto him, rabbi, thou art the son of
god; thou art the king of israel.

1:50 jesu answer and said unto him, becaus I said unto thee, I saw
the under the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things
than these.

1:51 and he saith unto him, verily, verily, I say unto you, hereafter
y shall see heaven open, and the angel of god ascend and
descend upon the son of man.

2:1 and the third day there wa a marriag in cana of galilee; and the
moth of jesu wa there: 2:2 and both jesu wa called, and his
disciples, to the marriage.

2:3 and when they want wine, the mother of jesu saith unto him,
they have no wine.

2:4 jesu saith unto her, woman, what have I to do with thee? mine
hour is not yet come.

2:5 hi mother saith unto the servants, whatsoev he saith unto you,
do it.

2:6 and there were set there six waterpot of stone, after the manner
of the purifi of the jews, contain two or three firkin apiece.

2:7 jesu saith unto them, fill the waterpot with water. and they
fil them up to the brim.

2:8 and he saith unto them, draw out now, and bear unto the governor
of the feast. and they bare it.

2:9 when the ruler of the feast had tast the water that wa made
wine, and knew not whenc it was: (but the servant which drew the
wat knew;) the governor of the feast call the bridegroom, 2:10 and
saith unto him, everi man at the begin doth set forth good wine;
and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast
kept the good wine until now.

2:11 thi begin of miracl did jesu in cana of galilee, and
manifest forth hi glory; and hi discipl believ on him.

2:12 after thi he went down to capernaum, he, and hi mother, and his
brethren, and hi disciples: and they continu there not mani days.

2:13 and the jews' passov wa at hand, and jesu went up to
jerusalem.

2:14 and found in the templ those that sold oxen and sheep and doves,
and the changer of money sitting: 2:15 and when he had made a scourge
of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep,
and the oxen; and pour out the changers' money, and overthrew the
tables; 2:16 and said unto them that sold doves, take these things
hence; make not my father' hous an hous of merchandise.

2:17 and hi discipl rememb that it wa written, the zeal of
thin hous hath eaten me up.

2:18 then answer the jew and said unto him, what sign shewest thou
unto us, see that thou doest these things?  2:19 jesu answer and
said unto them, destroy thi temple, and in three day I will rais it
up.

2:20 then said the jews, forti and six year wa thi templ in
building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?  2:21 but he spake
of the templ of hi body.

2:22 when therefor he wa risen from the dead, hi disciples
rememb that he had said thi unto them; and they believ the
scripture, and the word which jesu had said.

2:23 now when he wa in jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day,
mani believ in hi name, when they saw the miracl which he did.

2:24 but jesu did not commit himself unto them, becaus he knew all
men, 2:25 and need not that ani should testifi of man: for he knew
what wa in man.

3:1 there wa a man of the pharisees, name nicodemus, a ruler of the
jews: 3:2 the same came to jesu by night, and said unto him, rabbi,
w know that thou art a teacher come from god: for no man can do these
miracl that thou doest, except god be with him.

3:3 jesu answer and said unto him, verily, verily, I say unto thee,
except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of god.

3:4 nicodemu saith unto him, how can a man be born when he is old?
can he enter the second time into hi mother' womb, and be born?  3:5
jesu answered, verily, verily, I say unto thee, except a man be born
of water and of the spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of god.

3:6 that which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born
of the spirit is spirit.

3:7 marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.

3:8 the wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound
thereof, but canst not tell whenc it cometh, and whither it goeth: so
i everi one that is born of the spirit.

3:9 nicodemu answer and said unto him, how can these thing be?
3:10 jesu answer and said unto him, art thou a master of israel,
and knowest not these things?  3:11 verily, verily, I say unto thee,
w speak that we do know, and testifi that we have seen; and ye
rec not our witness.

3:12 If I have told you earthli things, and ye believ not, how shall
y believe, if I tell you of heavenli things?  3:13 and no man hath
ascend up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, even the son
of man which is in heaven.

3:14 and as mose lift up the serpent in the wilderness, even so
must the son of man be lift up: 3:15 that whosoev believeth in him
should not perish, but have etern life.

3:16 for god so love the world, that he gave hi onli begotten son,
that whosoev believeth in him should not perish, but have
everlast life.

3:17 for god sent not hi son into the world to condemn the world; but
that the world through him might be saved.

3:18 He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth
not is condemn already, becaus he hath not believ in the name of
th onli begotten son of god.

3:19 and thi is the condemnation, that light is come into the world,
and men love dark rather than light, becaus their deed were
evil.

3:20 for everi one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to
th light, lest hi deed should be reproved.

3:21 but he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that hi deed may
b made manifest, that they are wrought in god.

3:22 after these thing came jesu and hi discipl into the land of
judaea; and there he tarri with them, and baptized.

3:23 and john also wa baptiz in aenon near to salim, becaus there
wa much water there: and they came, and were baptized.

3:24 for john wa not yet cast into prison.

3:25 then there aros a question between some of john' discipl and
th jew about purifying.

3:26 and they came unto john, and said unto him, rabbi, he that was
with thee beyond jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same
baptizeth, and all men come to him.

3:27 john answer and said, A man can receiv nothing, except it be
given him from heaven.

3:28 Ye yourselv bear me witness, that I said, I am not the christ,
but that I am sent befor him.

3:29 He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the
bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatli because
of the bridegroom' voice: thi my joy therefor is fulfilled.

3:30 He must increase, but I must decrease.

3:31 He that cometh from abov is abov all: he that is of the earth
i earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is
abov all.

3:32 and what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man
receiveth hi testimony.

3:33 He that hath receiv hi testimoni hath set to hi seal that god
i true.

3:34 for he whom god hath sent speaketh the word of god: for god
giveth not the spirit by measur unto him.

3:35 the father loveth the son, and hath given all thing into his
hand.

3:36 He that believeth on the son hath everlast life: and he that
believeth not the son shall not see life; but the wrath of god abideth
on him.

4:1 when therefor the lord knew how the pharise had heard that
jesu made and baptiz more discipl than john, 4:2 (though jesus
himself baptiz not, but hi disciples,) 4:3 He left judaea, and
depart again into galilee.

4:4 and he must need go through samaria.

4:5 then cometh he to a citi of samaria, which is call sychar, near
to the parcel of ground that jacob gave to hi son joseph.

4:6 now jacob' well wa there. jesu therefore, be weari with
hi journey, sat thu on the well: and it wa about the sixth hour.

4:7 there cometh a woman of samaria to draw water: jesu saith unto
her, give me to drink.

4:8 (for hi discipl were gone away unto the citi to buy meat.)  4:9
then saith the woman of samaria unto him, how is it that thou, be a
jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of samaria? for the jews
hav no deal with the samaritans.

4:10 jesu answer and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of
god, and who it is that saith to thee, give me to drink; thou wouldest
hav ask of him, and he would have given thee live water.

4:11 the woman saith unto him, sir, thou hast noth to draw with,
and the well is deep: from whenc then hast thou that live water?
4:12 art thou greater than our father jacob, which gave us the well,
and drank thereof himself, and hi children, and hi cattle?  4:13
jesu answer and said unto her, whosoev drinketh of thi water
shal thirst again: 4:14 but whosoev drinketh of the water that i
shal give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him
shal be in him a well of water spring up into everlast life.

4:15 the woman saith unto him, sir, give me thi water, that I thirst
not, neither come hither to draw.

4:16 jesu saith unto her, go, call thi husband, and come hither.

4:17 the woman answer and said, I have no husband. jesu said unto
her, thou hast well said, I have no husband: 4:18 for thou hast had
fiv husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thi husband: in that
saidst thou truly.

4:19 the woman saith unto him, sir, I perceiv that thou art a
prophet.

4:20 our father worship in thi mountain; and ye say, that in
jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.

4:21 jesu saith unto her, woman, believ me, the hour cometh, when ye
shal neither in thi mountain, nor yet at jerusalem, worship the
father.

4:22 Ye worship ye know not what: we know what we worship: for
salv is of the jews.

4:23 but the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshipp shall
worship the father in spirit and in truth: for the father seeketh such
to worship him.

4:24 god is a spirit: and they that worship him must worship him in
spirit and in truth.

4:25 the woman saith unto him, I know that messia cometh, which is
cal christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

4:26 jesu saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.

4:27 and upon thi came hi disciples, and marvel that he talked
with the woman: yet no man said, what seekest thou? or, whi talkest
th with her?  4:28 the woman then left her waterpot, and went her
way into the city, and saith to the men, 4:29 come, see a man, which
told me all thing that ever I did: is not thi the christ?  4:30 then
they went out of the city, and came unto him.

4:31 In the mean while hi discipl pray him, saying, master, eat.

4:32 but he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not of.

4:33 therefor said the discipl one to another, hath ani man brought
him ought to eat?  4:34 jesu saith unto them, My meat is to do the
wil of him that sent me, and to finish hi work.

4:35 say not ye, there are yet four months, and then cometh harvest?
behold, I say unto you, lift up your eyes, and look on the fields; for
they are white alreadi to harvest.

4:36 and he that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto
lif eternal: that both he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice
together.

4:37 and herein is that say true, one soweth, and anoth reapeth.

4:38 I sent you to reap that whereon ye bestow no labour: other men
laboured, and ye are enter into their labours.

4:39 and mani of the samaritan of that citi believ on him for the
say of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.

4:40 So when the samaritan were come unto him, they besought him that
h would tarri with them: and he abod there two days.

4:41 and mani more believ becaus of hi own word; 4:42 and said
unto the woman, now we believe, not becaus of thi saying: for we have
heard him ourselves, and know that thi is inde the christ, the
saviour of the world.

4:43 now after two day he depart thence, and went into galilee.

4:44 for jesu himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his
own country.

4:45 then when he wa come into galilee, the galilaean receiv him,
hav seen all the thing that he did at jerusalem at the feast: for
they also went unto the feast.

4:46 So jesu came again into cana of galilee, where he made the water
wine. and there wa a certain nobleman, whose son wa sick at
capernaum.

4:47 when he heard that jesu wa come out of judaea into galilee, he
went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his
son: for he wa at the point of death.

4:48 then said jesu unto him, except ye see sign and wonders, ye
wil not believe.

4:49 the nobleman saith unto him, sir, come down ere my child die.

4:50 jesu saith unto him, Go thi way; thi son liveth. and the man
believ the word that jesu had spoken unto him, and he went hi way.

4:51 and as he wa now go down, hi servant met him, and told him,
saying, thi son liveth.

4:52 then enquir he of them the hour when he began to amend. and
they said unto him, yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.

4:53 So the father knew that it wa at the same hour, in the which
jesu said unto him, thi son liveth: and himself believed, and his
whol house.

4:54 thi is again the second miracl that jesu did, when he wa come
out of judaea into galilee.

5:1 after thi there wa a feast of the jews; and jesu went up to
jerusalem.

5:2 now there is at jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is
cal in the hebrew tongu bethesda, have five porches.

5:3 In these lay a great multitud of impot folk, of blind, halt,
withered, wait for the move of the water.

5:4 for an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and
troubl the water: whosoev then first after the troubl of the
wat step in wa made whole of whatsoev diseas he had.

5:5 and a certain man wa there, which had an infirm thirti and
eight years.

5:6 when jesu saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time
in that case, he saith unto him, wilt thou be made whole?  5:7 the
impot man answer him, sir, I have no man, when the water is
troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another
steppeth down befor me.

5:8 jesu saith unto him, rise, take up thi bed, and walk.

5:9 and immedi the man wa made whole, and took up hi bed, and
walked: and on the same day wa the sabbath.

5:10 the jew therefor said unto him that wa cured, It is the
sabbath day: it is not law for thee to carri thi bed.

5:11 He answer them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me,
tak up thi bed, and walk.

5:12 then ask they him, what man is that which said unto thee, take
up thi bed, and walk?  5:13 and he that wa heal wist not who it
was: for jesu had convey himself away, a multitud be in that
place.

5:14 afterward jesu findeth him in the temple, and said unto him,
behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a wors thing come unto
thee.

5:15 the man departed, and told the jew that it wa jesus, which had
mad him whole.

5:16 and therefor did the jew persecut jesus, and sought to slay
him, becaus he had done these thing on the sabbath day.

5:17 but jesu answer them, My father worketh hitherto, and I work.

5:18 therefor the jew sought the more to kill him, becaus he not
onli had broken the sabbath, but said also that god wa hi father,
mak himself equal with god.

5:19 then answer jesu and said unto them, verily, verily, I say
unto you, the son can do noth of himself, but what he seeth the
fath do: for what thing soever he doeth, these also doeth the son
likewise.

5:20 for the father loveth the son, and sheweth him all thing that
himself doeth: and he will shew him greater work than these, that ye
may marvel.

5:21 for as the father raiseth up the dead, and quickeneth them; even
so the son quickeneth whom he will.

5:22 for the father judgeth no man, but hath commit all judgment
unto the son: 5:23 that all men should honour the son, even as they
honour the father.

h that honoureth not the son honoureth not the father which hath sent
him.

5:24 verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and
believeth on him that sent me, hath everlast life, and shall not
com into condemnation; but is pass from death unto life.

5:25 verily, verily, I say unto you, the hour is coming, and now is,
when the dead shall hear the voic of the son of god: and they that
hear shall live.

5:26 for as the father hath life in himself; so hath he given to the
son to have life in himself; 5:27 and hath given him author to
execut judgment also, becaus he is the son of man.

5:28 marvel not at this: for the hour is coming, in the which all that
ar in the grave shall hear hi voice, 5:29 and shall come forth;
they that have done good, unto the resurrect of life; and they that
hav done evil, unto the resurrect of damnation.

5:30 I can of mine own self do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my
judg is just; becaus I seek not mine own will, but the will of
th father which hath sent me.

5:31 If I bear wit of myself, my wit is not true.

5:32 there is anoth that beareth wit of me; and I know that the
wit which he witnesseth of me is true.

5:33 Ye sent unto john, and he bare wit unto the truth.

5:34 but I receiv not testimoni from man: but these thing I say,
that ye might be saved.

5:35 He wa a burn and a shine light: and ye were will for a
season to rejoic in hi light.

5:36 but I have greater wit than that of john: for the work which
th father hath given me to finish, the same work that I do, bear
wit of me, that the father hath sent me.

5:37 and the father himself, which hath sent me, hath born wit of
me.

y have neither heard hi voic at ani time, nor seen hi shape.

5:38 and ye have not hi word abid in you: for whom he hath sent,
him ye believ not.

5:39 search the scriptures; for in them ye think ye have etern life:
and they are they which testifi of me.

5:40 and ye will not come to me, that ye might have life.

5:41 I receiv not honour from men.

5:42 but I know you, that ye have not the love of god in you.

5:43 I am come in my father' name, and ye receiv me not: if another
shal come in hi own name, him ye will receive.

5:44 how can ye believe, which receiv honour one of another, and seek
not the honour that cometh from god only?  5:45 Do not think that i
wil accus you to the father: there is one that accuseth you, even
moses, in whom ye trust.

5:46 for had ye believ moses, ye would have believ me; for he
wrot of me.

5:47 but if ye believ not hi writings, how shall ye believ my
words?  6:1 after these thing jesu went over the sea of galilee,
which is the sea of tiberias.

6:2 and a great multitud follow him, becaus they saw hi miracles
which he did on them that were diseased.

6:3 and jesu went up into a mountain, and there he sat with his
disciples.

6:4 and the passover, a feast of the jews, wa nigh.

6:5 when jesu then lift up hi eyes, and saw a great compani come
unto him, he saith unto philip, whenc shall we buy bread, that these
may eat?  6:6 and thi he said to prove him: for he himself knew what
h would do.

6:7 philip answer him, two hundr pennyworth of bread is not
suffici for them, that everi one of them may take a little.

6:8 one of hi disciples, andrew, simon peter' brother, saith unto
him, 6:9 there is a lad here, which hath five barley loaves, and two
smal fishes: but what are they among so many?  6:10 and jesu said,
mak the men sit down. now there wa much grass in the place. So the
men sat down, in number about five thousand.

6:11 and jesu took the loaves; and when he had given thanks, he
distribut to the disciples, and the discipl to them that were set
down; and likewis of the fish as much as they would.

6:12 when they were filled, he said unto hi disciples, gather up the
frag that remain, that noth be lost.

6:13 therefor they gather them together, and fill twelv baskets
with the fragment of the five barley loaves, which remain over and
abov unto them that had eaten.

6:14 then those men, when they had seen the miracl that jesu did,
said, thi is of a truth that prophet that should come into the world.

6:15 when jesu therefor perceiv that they would come and take him
bi force, to make him a king, he depart again into a mountain
himself alone.

6:16 and when even wa now come, hi discipl went down unto the sea,
6:17 and enter into a ship, and went over the sea toward capernaum.
and it wa now dark, and jesu wa not come to them.

6:18 and the sea aros by reason of a great wind that blew.

6:19 So when they had row about five and twenti or thirti furlongs,
they see jesu walk on the sea, and draw nigh unto the ship: and
they were afraid.

6:20 but he saith unto them, It is I; be not afraid.

6:21 then they willingli receiv him into the ship: and immediately
th ship wa at the land whither they went.

6:22 the day following, when the peopl which stood on the other side
of the sea saw that there wa none other boat there, save that one
whereinto hi discipl were entered, and that jesu went not with his
