discipl into the boat, but that hi discipl were gone away alone;
6:23 (howbeit there came other boat from tiberia nigh unto the place
wher they did eat bread, after that the lord had given thanks:) 6:24
when the peopl therefor saw that jesu wa not there, neither his
disciples, they also took shipping, and came to capernaum, seek for
jesus.

6:25 and when they had found him on the other side of the sea, they
said unto him, rabbi, when camest thou hither?  6:26 jesu answered
them and said, verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye seek me, not because
y saw the miracles, but becaus ye did eat of the loaves, and were
filled.

6:27 labour not for the meat which perisheth, but for that meat which
endureth unto everlast life, which the son of man shall give unto
you: for him hath god the father sealed.

6:28 then said they unto him, what shall we do, that we might work the
work of god?  6:29 jesu answer and said unto them, thi is the
work of god, that ye believ on him whom he hath sent.

6:30 they said therefor unto him, what sign shewest thou then, that
w may see, and believ thee? what dost thou work?  6:31 our fathers
did eat manna in the desert; as it is written, He gave them bread from
heaven to eat.

6:32 then jesu said unto them, verily, verily, I say unto you, moses
gav you not that bread from heaven; but my father giveth you the true
bread from heaven.

6:33 for the bread of god is he which cometh down from heaven, and
giveth life unto the world.

6:34 then said they unto him, lord, evermor give us thi bread.

6:35 and jesu said unto them, I am the bread of life: he that cometh
to me shall never hunger; and he that believeth on me shall never
thirst.

6:36 but I said unto you, that ye also have seen me, and believ not.

6:37 all that the father giveth me shall come to me; and him that
cometh to me I will in no wise cast out.

6:38 for I came down from heaven, not to do mine own will, but the
wil of him that sent me.

6:39 and thi is the father' will which hath sent me, that of all
which he hath given me I should lose nothing, but should rais it up
again at the last day.

6:40 and thi is the will of him that sent me, that everi one which
seeth the son, and believeth on him, may have everlast life: and i
wil rais him up at the last day.

6:41 the jew then murmur at him, becaus he said, I am the bread
which came down from heaven.

6:42 and they said, Is not thi jesus, the son of joseph, whose father
and mother we know? how is it then that he saith, I came down from
heaven?  6:43 jesu therefor answer and said unto them, murmur not
among yourselves.

6:44 No man can come to me, except the father which hath sent me draw
him: and I will rais him up at the last day.

6:45 It is written in the prophets, and they shall be all taught of
god.

everi man therefor that hath heard, and hath learn of the father,
cometh unto me.

6:46 not that ani man hath seen the father, save he which is of god,
h hath seen the father.

6:47 verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me hath
everlast life.

6:48 I am that bread of life.

6:49 your father did eat manna in the wilderness, and are dead.

6:50 thi is the bread which cometh down from heaven, that a man may
eat thereof, and not die.

6:51 I am the live bread which came down from heaven: if ani man eat
of thi bread, he shall live for ever: and the bread that I will give
i my flesh, which I will give for the life of the world.

6:52 the jew therefor strove among themselves, saying, how can this
man give us hi flesh to eat?  6:53 then jesu said unto them, verily,
verily, I say unto you, except ye eat the flesh of the son of man, and
drink hi blood, ye have no life in you.

6:54 whoso eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath etern life;
and I will rais him up at the last day.

6:55 for my flesh is meat indeed, and my blood is drink indeed.

6:56 He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me,
and I in him.

6:57 As the live father hath sent me, and I live by the father: so
h that eateth me, even he shall live by me.

6:58 thi is that bread which came down from heaven: not as your
fath did eat manna, and are dead: he that eateth of thi bread
shal live for ever.

6:59 these thing said he in the synagogue, as he taught in capernaum.

6:60 mani therefor of hi disciples, when they had heard this, said,
thi is an hard saying; who can hear it?  6:61 when jesu knew in
himself that hi discipl murmur at it, he said unto them, doth
thi offend you?  6:62 what and if ye shall see the son of man ascend
up where he wa before?  6:63 It is the spirit that quickeneth; the
flesh profiteth nothing: the word that I speak unto you, they are
spirit, and they are life.

6:64 but there are some of you that believ not. for jesu knew from
th begin who they were that believ not, and who should betray
him.

6:65 and he said, therefor said I unto you, that no man can come unto
me, except it were given unto him of my father.

6:66 from that time mani of hi discipl went back, and walk no
mor with him.

6:67 then said jesu unto the twelve, will ye also go away?  6:68 then
simon peter answer him, lord, to whom shall we go? thou hast the
word of etern life.

6:69 and we believ and are sure that thou art that christ, the son of
th live god.

6:70 jesu answer them, have not I chosen you twelve, and one of you
i a devil?  6:71 He spake of juda iscariot the son of simon: for he
it wa that should betray him, be one of the twelve.

7:1 after these thing jesu walk in galilee: for he would not walk
in jewry, becaus the jew sought to kill him.

7:2 now the jew' feast of tabernacl wa at hand.

7:3 hi brethren therefor said unto him, depart hence, and go into
judaea, that thi discipl also may see the work that thou doest.

7:4 for there is no man that doeth ani thing in secret, and he himself
seeketh to be known openly. If thou do these things, shew thyself to
th world.

7:5 for neither did hi brethren believ in him.

7:6 then jesu said unto them, My time is not yet come: but your time
i alway ready.

7:7 the world cannot hate you; but me it hateth, becaus I testifi of
it, that the work thereof are evil.

7:8 Go ye up unto thi feast: I go not up yet unto thi feast: for my
tim is not yet full come.

7:9 when he had said these word unto them, he abod still in galilee.

7:10 but when hi brethren were gone up, then went he also up unto the
feast, not openly, but as it were in secret.

7:11 then the jew sought him at the feast, and said, where is he?
7:12 and there wa much murmur among the peopl concern him: for
som said, He is a good man: other said, nay; but he deceiveth the
people.

7:13 howbeit no man spake openli of him for fear of the jews.

7:14 now about the midst of the feast jesu went up into the temple,
and taught.

7:15 and the jew marvelled, saying, how knoweth thi man letters,
hav never learned?  7:16 jesu answer them, and said, My doctrine
i not mine, but hi that sent me.

7:17 If ani man will do hi will, he shall know of the doctrine,
wheth it be of god, or whether I speak of myself.

7:18 He that speaketh of himself seeketh hi own glory: but he that
seeketh hi glori that sent him, the same is true, and no
unright is in him.

7:19 did not mose give you the law, and yet none of you keepeth the
law?  whi go ye about to kill me?  7:20 the peopl answer and said,
thou hast a devil: who goeth about to kill thee?  7:21 jesu answered
and said unto them, I have done one work, and ye all marvel.

7:22 mose therefor gave unto you circumcision; (not becaus it is of
moses, but of the fathers;) and ye on the sabbath day circumcis a
man.

7:23 If a man on the sabbath day receiv circumcision, that the law of
mos should not be broken; are ye angri at me, becaus I have made a
man everi whit whole on the sabbath day?  7:24 judg not accord to
th appearance, but judg righteou judgment.

7:25 then said some of them of jerusalem, Is not thi he, whom they
seek to kill?  7:26 but, lo, he speaketh boldly, and they say nothing
unto him. Do the ruler know inde that thi is the veri christ?
7:27 howbeit we know thi man whenc he is: but when christ cometh, no
man knoweth whenc he is.

7:28 then cri jesu in the templ as he taught, saying, Ye both know
me, and ye know whenc I am: and I am not come of myself, but he that
sent me is true, whom ye know not.

7:29 but I know him: for I am from him, and he hath sent me.

7:30 then they sought to take him: but no man laid hand on him,
becaus hi hour wa not yet come.

7:31 and mani of the peopl believ on him, and said, when christ
cometh, will he do more miracl than these which thi man hath done?
7:32 the pharise heard that the peopl murmur such things
concern him; and the pharise and the chief priest sent officers
to take him.

7:33 then said jesu unto them, yet a littl while am I with you, and
then I go unto him that sent me.

7:34 Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither
y cannot come.

7:35 then said the jew among themselves, whither will he go, that we
shal not find him? will he go unto the dispers among the gentiles,
and teach the gentiles?  7:36 what manner of say is thi that he
said, Ye shall seek me, and shall not find me: and where I am, thither
y cannot come?  7:37 In the last day, that great day of the feast,
jesu stood and cried, saying, If ani man thirst, let him come unto
me, and drink.

7:38 He that believeth on me, as the scriptur hath said, out of his
belli shall flow river of live water.

7:39 (but thi spake he of the spirit, which they that believ on him
should receive: for the holi ghost wa not yet given; becaus that
jesu wa not yet glorified.)  7:40 mani of the peopl therefore, when
they heard thi saying, said, Of a truth thi is the prophet.

7:41 other said, thi is the christ. but some said, shall christ come
out of galilee?  7:42 hath not the scriptur said, that christ cometh
of the seed of david, and out of the town of bethlehem, where david
was?  7:43 So there wa a divis among the peopl becaus of him.

7:44 and some of them would have taken him; but no man laid hand on
him.

7:45 then came the offic to the chief priest and pharisees; and
they said unto them, whi have ye not brought him?  7:46 the officers
answered, never man spake like thi man.

7:47 then answer them the pharisees, are ye also deceived?  7:48
have ani of the ruler or of the pharise believ on him?  7:49 but
thi peopl who knoweth not the law are cursed.

7:50 nicodemu saith unto them, (he that came to jesu by night, being
on of them,) 7:51 doth our law judg ani man, befor it hear him, and
know what he doeth?  7:52 they answer and said unto him, art thou
also of galilee?  search, and look: for out of galile ariseth no
prophet.

7:53 and everi man went unto hi own house.

8:1 jesu went unto the mount of olives.

8:2 and earli in the morn he came again into the temple, and all
th peopl came unto him; and he sat down, and taught them.

8:3 and the scribe and pharise brought unto him a woman taken in
adultery; and when they had set her in the midst, 8:4 they say unto
him, master, thi woman wa taken in adultery, in the veri act.

8:5 now mose in the law command us, that such should be stoned: but
what sayest thou?  8:6 thi they said, tempt him, that they might
hav to accus him. but jesu stoop down, and with hi finger wrote
on the ground, as though he heard them not.

8:7 So when they continu ask him, he lift up himself, and said
unto them, He that is without sin among you, let him first cast a
ston at her.

8:8 and again he stoop down, and wrote on the ground.

8:9 and they which heard it, be convict by their own conscience,
w out one by one, begin at the eldest, even unto the last: and
jesu wa left alone, and the woman stand in the midst.

8:10 when jesu had lift up himself, and saw none but the woman, he
said unto her, woman, where are those thine accusers? hath no man
condemn thee?  8:11 she said, No man, lord. and jesu said unto her,
neith do I condemn thee: go, and sin no more.

8:12 then spake jesu again unto them, saying, I am the light of the
world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness, but shall have
th light of life.

8:13 the pharise therefor said unto him, thou bearest record of
thyself; thi record is not true.

8:14 jesu answer and said unto them, though I bear record of
myself, yet my record is true: for I know whenc I came, and whither i
go; but ye cannot tell whenc I come, and whither I go.

8:15 Ye judg after the flesh; I judg no man.

8:16 and yet if I judge, my judgment is true: for I am not alone, but
i and the father that sent me.

8:17 It is also written in your law, that the testimoni of two men is
true.

8:18 I am one that bear wit of myself, and the father that sent me
beareth wit of me.

8:19 then said they unto him, where is thi father? jesu answered, ye
neith know me, nor my father: if ye had known me, ye should have
known my father also.

8:20 these word spake jesu in the treasury, as he taught in the
temple: and no man laid hand on him; for hi hour wa not yet come.

8:21 then said jesu again unto them, I go my way, and ye shall seek
me, and shall die in your sins: whither I go, ye cannot come.

8:22 then said the jews, will he kill himself? becaus he saith,
whith I go, ye cannot come.

8:23 and he said unto them, Ye are from beneath; I am from above: ye
ar of thi world; I am not of thi world.

8:24 I said therefor unto you, that ye shall die in your sins: for if
y believ not that I am he, ye shall die in your sins.

8:25 then said they unto him, who art thou? and jesu saith unto them,
even the same that I said unto you from the beginning.

8:26 I have mani thing to say and to judg of you: but he that sent
m is true; and I speak to the world those thing which I have heard
of him.

8:27 they understood not that he spake to them of the father.

8:28 then said jesu unto them, when ye have lift up the son of man,
then shall ye know that I am he, and that I do noth of myself; but
a my father hath taught me, I speak these things.

8:29 and he that sent me is with me: the father hath not left me
alone; for I do alway those thing that pleas him.

8:30 As he spake these words, mani believ on him.

8:31 then said jesu to those jew which believ on him, If ye
continu in my word, then are ye my discipl indeed; 8:32 and ye
shal know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

8:33 they answer him, We be abraham' seed, and were never in
bondag to ani man: how sayest thou, Ye shall be made free?  8:34
jesu answer them, verily, verily, I say unto you, whosoever
committeth sin is the servant of sin.

8:35 and the servant abideth not in the hous for ever: but the son
abideth ever.

8:36 If the son therefor shall make you free, ye shall be free
indeed.

8:37 I know that ye are abraham' seed; but ye seek to kill me,
becaus my word hath no place in you.

8:38 I speak that which I have seen with my father: and ye do that
which ye have seen with your father.

8:39 they answer and said unto him, abraham is our father. jesus
saith unto them, If ye were abraham' children, ye would do the works
of abraham.

8:40 but now ye seek to kill me, a man that hath told you the truth,
which I have heard of god: thi did not abraham.

8:41 Ye do the deed of your father. then said they to him, We be not
born of fornication; we have one father, even god.

8:42 jesu said unto them, If god were your father, ye would love me:
for I proceed forth and came from god; neither came I of myself, but
h sent me.

8:43 whi do ye not understand my speech? even becaus ye cannot hear
mi word.

8:44 Ye are of your father the devil, and the lust of your father ye
wil do. He wa a murder from the beginning, and abod not in the
truth, becaus there is no truth in him. when he speaketh a lie, he
speaketh of hi own: for he is a liar, and the father of it.

8:45 and becaus I tell you the truth, ye believ me not.

8:46 which of you convinceth me of sin? and if I say the truth, whi do
y not believ me?  8:47 He that is of god heareth god' words: ye
therefor hear them not, becaus ye are not of god.

8:48 then answer the jews, and said unto him, say we not well that
thou art a samaritan, and hast a devil?  8:49 jesu answered, I have
not a devil; but I honour my father, and ye do dishonour me.

8:50 and I seek not mine own glory: there is one that seeketh and
judgeth.

8:51 verily, verily, I say unto you, If a man keep my saying, he shall
nev see death.

8:52 then said the jew unto him, now we know that thou hast a devil.

abraham is dead, and the prophets; and thou sayest, If a man keep my
saying, he shall never tast of death.

8:53 art thou greater than our father abraham, which is dead? and the
prophet are dead: whom makest thou thyself?  8:54 jesu answered, if
i honour myself, my honour is nothing: it is my father that honoureth
me; of whom ye say, that he is your god: 8:55 yet ye have not known
him; but I know him: and if I should say, I know him not, I shall be a
liar like unto you: but I know him, and keep hi saying.

8:56 your father abraham rejoic to see my day: and he saw it, and
wa glad.

8:57 then said the jew unto him, thou art not yet fifti year old,
and hast thou seen abraham?  8:58 jesu said unto them, verily,
verily, I say unto you, befor abraham was, I am.

8:59 then took they up stone to cast at him: but jesu hid himself,
and went out of the temple, go through the midst of them, and so
pass by.

9:1 and as jesu pass by, he saw a man which wa blind from his
birth.

9:2 and hi discipl ask him, saying, master, who did sin, this
man, or hi parents, that he wa born blind?  9:3 jesu answered,
neith hath thi man sinned, nor hi parents: but that the work of
god should be made manifest in him.

9:4 I must work the work of him that sent me, while it is day: the
night cometh, when no man can work.

9:5 As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

9:6 when he had thu spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of
th spittle, and he anoint the eye of the blind man with the clay,
9:7 and said unto him, go, wash in the pool of siloam, (which is by
interpretation, sent.) He went hi way therefore, and washed, and came
seeing.

9:8 the neighbour therefore, and they which befor had seen him that
h wa blind, said, Is not thi he that sat and begged?  9:9 some
said, thi is he: other said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.

9:10 therefor said they unto him, how were thine eye opened?  9:11
he answer and said, A man that is call jesu made clay, and
anoint mine eyes, and said unto me, Go to the pool of siloam, and
wash: and I went and washed, and I receiv sight.

9:12 then said they unto him, where is he? He said, I know not.

9:13 they brought to the pharise him that aforetim wa blind.

9:14 and it wa the sabbath day when jesu made the clay, and opened
hi eyes.

9:15 then again the pharise also ask him how he had receiv his
sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed,
and do see.

9:16 therefor said some of the pharisees, thi man is not of god,
becaus he keepeth not the sabbath day. other said, how can a man
that is a sinner do such miracles? and there wa a divis among
them.

9:17 they say unto the blind man again, what sayest thou of him, that
h hath open thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.

9:18 but the jew did not believ concern him, that he had been
blind, and receiv hi sight, until they call the parent of him
that had receiv hi sight.

9:19 and they ask them, saying, Is thi your son, who ye say was
born blind? how then doth he now see?  9:20 hi parent answer them
and said, We know that thi is our son, and that he wa born blind:
9:21 but by what mean he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened
hi eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for
himself.

9:22 these word spake hi parents, becaus they fear the jews: for
th jew had agre already, that if ani man did confess that he was
christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

9:23 therefor said hi parents, He is of age; ask him.

9:24 then again call they the man that wa blind, and said unto him,
giv god the praise: we know that thi man is a sinner.

9:25 He answer and said, whether he be a sinner or no, I know not:
on thing I know, that, wherea I wa blind, now I see.

9:26 then said they to him again, what did he to thee? how open he
thin eyes?  9:27 He answer them, I have told you already, and ye
did not hear: wherefor would ye hear it again? will ye also be his
disciples?  9:28 then they revil him, and said, thou art his
disciple; but we are moses' disciples.

9:29 We know that god spake unto moses: as for thi fellow, we know
not from whenc he is.

9:30 the man answer and said unto them, whi herein is a marvellous
thing, that ye know not from whenc he is, and yet he hath open mine
eyes.

9:31 now we know that god heareth not sinners: but if ani man be a
worshipp of god, and doeth hi will, him he heareth.

9:32 sinc the world began wa it not heard that ani man open the
ey of one that wa born blind.

9:33 If thi man were not of god, he could do nothing.

9:34 they answer and said unto him, thou wast altogeth born in
sins, and dost thou teach us? and they cast him out.

9:35 jesu heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found
him, he said unto him, dost thou believ on the son of god?  9:36 he
answ and said, who is he, lord, that I might believ on him?  9:37
and jesu said unto him, thou hast both seen him, and it is he that
talketh with thee.

9:38 and he said, lord, I believe. and he worship him.

9:39 and jesu said, for judgment I am come into thi world, that they
which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

9:40 and some of the pharise which were with him heard these words,
and said unto him, are we blind also?  9:41 jesu said unto them, if
y were blind, ye should have no sin: but now ye say, We see;
therefor your sin remaineth.

10:1 verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door
into the sheepfold, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a
thief and a robber.

10:2 but he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

10:3 To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear hi voice: and he
calleth hi own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

10:4 and when he putteth forth hi own sheep, he goeth befor them,
and the sheep follow him: for they know hi voice.

10:5 and a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for
they know not the voic of strangers.

10:6 thi parabl spake jesu unto them: but they understood not what
th they were which he spake unto them.

10:7 then said jesu unto them again, verily, verily, I say unto you,
i am the door of the sheep.

10:8 all that ever came befor me are thiev and robbers: but the
sheep did not hear them.

10:9 I am the door: by me if ani man enter in, he shall be saved, and
shal go in and out, and find pasture.

10:10 the thief cometh not, but for to steal, and to kill, and to
destroy: I am come that they might have life, and that they might have
it more abundantly.

10:11 I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd giveth hi life for
th sheep.

10:12 but he that is an hireling, and not the shepherd, whose own the
sheep are not, seeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and
fleeth: and the wolf catcheth them, and scattereth the sheep.

10:13 the hirel fleeth, becaus he is an hireling, and careth not
for the sheep.

10:14 I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.

10:15 As the father knoweth me, even so know I the father: and I lay
down my life for the sheep.

10:16 and other sheep I have, which are not of thi fold: them also i
must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be one fold,
and one shepherd.

10:17 therefor doth my father love me, becaus I lay down my life,
that I might take it again.

10:18 No man taketh it from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have
pow to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. this
command have I receiv of my father.

10:19 there wa a divis therefor again among the jew for these
sayings.

10:20 and mani of them said, He hath a devil, and is mad; whi hear ye
him?  10:21 other said, these are not the word of him that hath a
devil. can a devil open the eye of the blind?  10:22 and it wa at
jerusalem the feast of the dedication, and it wa winter.

10:23 and jesu walk in the templ in solomon' porch.

10:24 then came the jew round about him, and said unto him, how long
dost thou make us to doubt? If thou be the christ, tell us plainly.

10:25 jesu answer them, I told you, and ye believ not: the works
that I do in my father' name, they bear wit of me.

10:26 but ye believ not, becaus ye are not of my sheep, as I said
unto you.

10:27 My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
10:28 and I give unto them etern life; and they shall never perish,
neith shall ani man pluck them out of my hand.

10:29 My father, which gave them me, is greater than all; and no man
i abl to pluck them out of my father' hand.

10:30 I and my father are one.

10:31 then the jew took up stone again to stone him.

10:32 jesu answer them, mani good work have I shew you from my
father; for which of those work do ye stone me?  10:33 the jews
answ him, saying, for a good work we stone thee not; but for
blasphemy; and becaus that thou, be a man, makest thyself god.

10:34 jesu answer them, Is it not written in your law, I said, ye
ar gods?  10:35 If he call them gods, unto whom the word of god
came, and the scriptur cannot be broken; 10:36 say ye of him, whom
th father hath sanctified, and sent into the world, thou blasphemest;
becaus I said, I am the son of god?  10:37 If I do not the work of
mi father, believ me not.

10:38 but if I do, though ye believ not me, believ the works: that
y may know, and believe, that the father is in me, and I in him.

10:39 therefor they sought again to take him: but he escap out of
their hand, 10:40 and went away again beyond jordan into the place
wher john at first baptized; and there he abode.

10:41 and mani resort unto him, and said, john did no miracle: but
al thing that john spake of thi man were true.

10:42 and mani believ on him there.

11:1 now a certain man wa sick, name lazarus, of bethany, the town
of mari and her sister martha.

11:2 (it wa that mari which anoint the lord with ointment, and
wip hi feet with her hair, whose brother lazaru wa sick.)  11:3
therefor hi sister sent unto him, saying, lord, behold, he whom
thou lovest is sick.

11:4 when jesu heard that, he said, thi sick is not unto death,
but for the glori of god, that the son of god might be glorified
thereby.

11:5 now jesu love martha, and her sister, and lazarus.

11:6 when he had heard therefor that he wa sick, he abod two days
stil in the same place where he was.

11:7 then after that saith he to hi disciples, let us go into judaea
again.

11:8 hi discipl say unto him, master, the jew of late sought to
ston thee; and goest thou thither again?  11:9 jesu answered, are
ther not twelv hour in the day? If ani man walk in the day, he
stumbleth not, becaus he seeth the light of thi world.

11:10 but if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, becaus there is
no light in him.

11:11 these thing said he: and after that he saith unto them, our
friend lazaru sleepeth; but I go, that I may awak him out of sleep.

11:12 then said hi disciples, lord, if he sleep, he shall do well.

11:13 howbeit jesu spake of hi death: but they thought that he had
spoken of take of rest in sleep.

11:14 then said jesu unto them plainly, lazaru is dead.

11:15 and I am glad for your sake that I wa not there, to the intent
y may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.

11:16 then said thomas, which is call didymus, unto his
fellowdisciples, let us also go, that we may die with him.

11:17 then when jesu came, he found that he had lain in the grave
four day already.

11:18 now bethani wa nigh unto jerusalem, about fifteen furlong off:
11:19 and mani of the jew came to martha and mary, to comfort them
concern their brother.

11:20 then martha, as soon as she heard that jesu wa coming, went
and met him: but mari sat still in the house.

11:21 then said martha unto jesus, lord, if thou hadst been here, my
broth had not died.

11:22 but I know, that even now, whatsoev thou wilt ask of god, god
wil give it thee.

11:23 jesu saith unto her, thi brother shall rise again.

11:24 martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the
resurrect at the last day.

11:25 jesu said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he
that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live: 11:26
and whosoev liveth and believeth in me shall never die. believest
th this?  11:27 she saith unto him, yea, lord: I believ that thou
art the christ, the son of god, which should come into the world.

11:28 and when she had so said, she went her way, and call mari her
sist secretly, saying, the master is come, and calleth for thee.

11:29 As soon as she heard that, she aros quickly, and came unto him.

11:30 now jesu wa not yet come into the town, but wa in that place
wher martha met him.

11:31 the jew then which were with her in the house, and comforted
her, when they saw mary, that she rose up hastili and went out,
follow her, saying, she goeth unto the grave to weep there.

11:32 then when mari wa come where jesu was, and saw him, she fell
down at hi feet, say unto him, lord, if thou hadst been here, my
broth had not died.

11:33 when jesu therefor saw her weeping, and the jew also weeping
which came with her, he groan in the spirit, and wa troubled.

11:34 and said, where have ye laid him? they said unto him, lord, come
and see.

11:35 jesu wept.

11:36 then said the jews, behold how he love him!  11:37 and some of
them said, could not thi man, which open the eye of the blind,
hav caus that even thi man should not have died?  11:38 jesus
therefor again groan in himself cometh to the grave. It wa a
cave, and a stone lay upon it.

11:39 jesu said, take ye away the stone. martha, the sister of him
that wa dead, saith unto him, lord, by thi time he stinketh: for he
hath been dead four days.

11:40 jesu saith unto her, said I not unto thee, that, if thou
wouldest believe, thou shouldest see the glori of god?  11:41 then
they took away the stone from the place where the dead wa laid. and
jesu lift up hi eyes, and said, father, I thank thee that thou
hast heard me.

11:42 and I knew that thou hearest me always: but becaus of the
peopl which stand by I said it, that they may believ that thou hast
sent me.

11:43 and when he thu had spoken, he cri with a loud voice,
lazarus, come forth.

11:44 and he that wa dead came forth, bound hand and foot with
graveclothes: and hi face wa bound about with a napkin. jesu saith
unto them, loos him, and let him go.

11:45 then mani of the jew which came to mary, and had seen the
th which jesu did, believ on him.

11:46 but some of them went their way to the pharisees, and told them
what thing jesu had done.

11:47 then gather the chief priest and the pharise a council, and
said, what do we? for thi man doeth mani miracles.

11:48 If we let him thu alone, all men will believ on him: and the
roman shall come and take away both our place and nation.

11:49 and one of them, name caiaphas, be the high priest that same
year, said unto them, Ye know noth at all, 11:50 nor consid that
it is expedi for us, that one man should die for the people, and
that the whole nation perish not.

11:51 and thi spake he not of himself: but be high priest that
year, he prophesi that jesu should die for that nation; 11:52 and
not for that nation only, but that also he should gather togeth in
on the children of god that were scatter abroad.

11:53 then from that day forth they took counsel togeth for to put
him to death.

11:54 jesu therefor walk no more openli among the jews; but went
thenc unto a countri near to the wilderness, into a citi called
ephraim, and there continu with hi disciples.

11:55 and the jews' passov wa nigh at hand: and mani went out of
th countri up to jerusalem befor the passover, to purifi themselves.

11:56 then sought they for jesus, and spake among themselves, as they
stood in the temple, what think ye, that he will not come to the
feast?  11:57 now both the chief priest and the pharise had given a
commandment, that, if ani man knew where he were, he should shew it,
that they might take him.

12:1 then jesu six day befor the passov came to bethany, where
lazaru was, which had been dead, whom he rais from the dead.

12:2 there they made him a supper; and martha served: but lazaru was
on of them that sat at the tabl with him.

12:3 then took mari a pound of ointment of spikenard, veri costly, and
anoint the feet of jesus, and wipe hi feet with her hair: and the
hous wa fill with the odour of the ointment.

12:4 then saith one of hi disciples, juda iscariot, simon' son,
which should betray him, 12:5 whi wa not thi ointment sold for three
hundr pence, and given to the poor?  12:6 thi he said, not that he
car for the poor; but becaus he wa a thief, and had the bag, and
bar what wa put therein.

12:7 then said jesus, let her alone: against the day of my burying
hath she kept this.

12:8 for the poor alway ye have with you; but me ye have not always.

12:9 much peopl of the jew therefor knew that he wa there: and
they came not for jesus' sake only, but that they might see lazarus
also, whom he had rais from the dead.

12:10 but the chief priest consult that they might put lazaru also
to death; 12:11 becaus that by reason of him mani of the jew went
away, and believ on jesus.

12:12 On the next day much peopl that were come to the feast, when
they heard that jesu wa come to jerusalem, 12:13 took branch of
palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried, hosanna: bless is
th king of israel that cometh in the name of the lord.

12:14 and jesus, when he had found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is
written, 12:15 fear not, daughter of sion: behold, thi king cometh,
sit on an ass' colt.

12:16 these thing understood not hi discipl at the first: but when
jesu wa glorified, then rememb they that these thing were
written of him, and that they had done these thing unto him.

12:17 the peopl therefor that wa with him when he call lazarus
out of hi grave, and rais him from the dead, bare record.

12:18 for thi caus the peopl also met him, for that they heard that
h had done thi miracle.

12:19 the pharise therefor said among themselves, perceiv ye how
y prevail nothing? behold, the world is gone after him.

12:20 and there were certain greek among them that came up to worship
at the feast: 12:21 the same came therefor to philip, which wa of
bethsaida of galilee, and desir him, saying, sir, we would see
jesus.

12:22 philip cometh and telleth andrew: and again andrew and philip
tel jesus.

12:23 and jesu answer them, saying, the hour is come, that the son
of man should be glorified.

12:24 verily, verily, I say unto you, except a corn of wheat fall into
th ground and die, it abideth alone: but if it die, it bringeth forth
much fruit.

12:25 He that loveth hi life shall lose it; and he that hateth his
lif in thi world shall keep it unto life eternal.

12:26 If ani man serv me, let him follow me; and where I am, there
shal also my servant be: if ani man serv me, him will my father
honour.

12:27 now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? father, save me
from thi hour: but for thi caus came I unto thi hour.

12:28 father, glorifi thi name. then came there a voic from heaven,
saying, I have both glorifi it, and will glorifi it again.

12:29 the peopl therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it
thundered: other said, An angel spake to him.

12:30 jesu answer and said, thi voic came not becaus of me, but
for your sakes.

12:31 now is the judgment of thi world: now shall the princ of this
world be cast out.

12:32 and I, if I be lift up from the earth, will draw all men unto
me.

12:33 thi he said, signifi what death he should die.

12:34 the peopl answer him, We have heard out of the law that
christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, the son of man must be
lift up? who is thi son of man?  12:35 then jesu said unto them,
yet a littl while is the light with you.

walk while ye have the light, lest dark come upon you: for he that
walketh in dark knoweth not whither he goeth.

12:36 while ye have light, believ in the light, that ye may be the
children of light. these thing spake jesus, and departed, and did
hid himself from them.

12:37 but though he had done so mani miracl befor them, yet they
believ not on him: 12:38 that the say of esaia the prophet might
b fulfilled, which he spake, lord, who hath believ our report? and
to whom hath the arm of the lord been revealed?  12:39 therefor they
could not believe, becaus that esaia said again, 12:40 He hath
blind their eyes, and harden their heart; that they should not see
with their eyes, nor understand with their heart, and be converted,
and I should heal them.

12:41 these thing said esaias, when he saw hi glory, and spake of
him.

12:42 nevertheless among the chief ruler also mani believ on him;
but becaus of the pharise they did not confess him, lest they
should be put out of the synagogue: 12:43 for they love the prais of
men more than the prais of god.

12:44 jesu cri and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on
me, but on him that sent me.

12:45 and he that seeth me seeth him that sent me.

12:46 I am come a light into the world, that whosoev believeth on me
should not abid in darkness.

12:47 and if ani man hear my words, and believ not, I judg him not:
for I came not to judg the world, but to save the world.

12:48 He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my words, hath one that
judgeth him: the word that I have spoken, the same shall judg him in
th last day.

12:49 for I have not spoken of myself; but the father which sent me,
h gave me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.

12:50 and I know that hi command is life everlasting: whatsoever
i speak therefore, even as the father said unto me, so I speak.

13:1 now befor the feast of the passover, when jesu knew that his
hour wa come that he should depart out of thi world unto the father,
hav love hi own which were in the world, he love them unto the
end.

13:2 and supper be ended, the devil have now put into the heart
of juda iscariot, simon' son, to betray him; 13:3 jesu know that
th father had given all thing into hi hands, and that he wa come
from god, and went to god; 13:4 He riseth from supper, and laid aside
hi garments; and took a towel, and gird himself.

13:5 after that he poureth water into a bason, and began to wash the
disciples' feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was
girded.

13:6 then cometh he to simon peter: and peter saith unto him, lord,
dost thou wash my feet?  13:7 jesu answer and said unto him, what i
do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know hereafter.

13:8 peter saith unto him, thou shalt never wash my feet. jesus
answ him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.

13:9 simon peter saith unto him, lord, not my feet only, but also my
hand and my head.

13:10 jesu saith to him, He that is wash needeth not save to wash
hi feet, but is clean everi whit: and ye are clean, but not all.

13:11 for he knew who should betray him; therefor said he, Ye are not
al clean.

13:12 So after he had wash their feet, and had taken hi garments,
and wa set down again, he said unto them, know ye what I have done to
you?  13:13 Ye call me master and lord: and ye say well; for so I am.

13:14 If I then, your lord and master, have wash your feet; ye also
ought to wash one another' feet.

13:15 for I have given you an example, that ye should do as I have
don to you.

13:16 verily, verily, I say unto you, the servant is not greater than
hi lord; neither he that is sent greater than he that sent him.

13:17 If ye know these things, happi are ye if ye do them.

13:18 I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the
scriptur may be fulfilled, He that eateth bread with me hath lifted
up hi heel against me.

13:19 now I tell you befor it come, that, when it is come to pass, ye
may believ that I am he.

13:20 verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoev i
send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent
me.

13:21 when jesu had thu said, he wa troubl in spirit, and
testified, and said, verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you
shal betray me.

13:22 then the discipl look one on another, doubt of whom he
spake.

13:23 now there wa lean on jesus' bosom one of hi disciples, whom
jesu loved.

13:24 simon peter therefor beckon to him, that he should ask who it
should be of whom he spake.

13:25 He then lie on jesus' breast saith unto him, lord, who is it?
13:26 jesu answered, He it is, to whom I shall give a sop, when i
hav dip it. and when he had dip the sop, he gave it to judas
iscariot, the son of simon.

13:27 and after the sop satan enter into him. then said jesu unto
him, that thou doest, do quickly.

13:28 now no man at the tabl knew for what intent he spake thi unto
him.

13:29 for some of them thought, becaus juda had the bag, that jesus
had said unto him, buy those thing that we have need of against the
feast; or, that he should give someth to the poor.

13:30 He then have receiv the sop went immedi out: and it was
night.

13:31 therefore, when he wa gone out, jesu said, now is the son of
man glorified, and god is glorifi in him.

13:32 If god be glorifi in him, god shall also glorifi him in
himself, and shall straightway glorifi him.

13:33 littl children, yet a littl while I am with you. Ye shall seek
me: and as I said unto the jews, whither I go, ye cannot come; so now
i say to you.

13:34 A new command I give unto you, that ye love one another; as
i have love you, that ye also love one another.

13:35 By thi shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have
lov one to another.

13:36 simon peter said unto him, lord, whither goest thou? jesus
answ him, whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou
shalt follow me afterwards.

13:37 peter said unto him, lord, whi cannot I follow thee now? I will
lay down my life for thi sake.

13:38 jesu answer him, wilt thou lay down thi life for my sake?
verily, verily, I say unto thee, the cock shall not crow, till thou
hast deni me thrice.

14:1 let not your heart be troubled: ye believ in god, believ also
in me.

14:2 In my father' hous are mani mansions: if it were not so, i
would have told you. I go to prepar a place for you.

14:3 and if I go and prepar a place for you, I will come again, and
rec you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.

14:4 and whither I go ye know, and the way ye know.

14:5 thoma saith unto him, lord, we know not whither thou goest; and
how can we know the way?  14:6 jesu saith unto him, I am the way, the
truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the father, but by me.

14:7 If ye had known me, ye should have known my father also: and from
henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.

14:8 philip saith unto him, lord, shew us the father, and it sufficeth
us.

14:9 jesu saith unto him, have I been so long time with you, and yet
hast thou not known me, philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the
father; and how sayest thou then, shew us the father?  14:10 believest
th not that I am in the father, and the father in me?  the words
that I speak unto you I speak not of myself: but the father that
dwelleth in me, he doeth the works.

14:11 believ me that I am in the father, and the father in me: or
els believ me for the veri works' sake.

14:12 verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the
work that I do shall he do also; and greater work than these shall
h do; becaus I go unto my father.

14:13 and whatsoev ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the
fath may be glorifi in the son.

14:14 If ye shall ask ani thing in my name, I will do it.

14:15 If ye love me, keep my commandments.

14:16 and I will pray the father, and he shall give you another
comforter, that he may abid with you for ever; 14:17 even the spirit
of truth; whom the world cannot receive, becaus it seeth him not,
neith knoweth him: but ye know him; for he dwelleth with you, and
shal be in you.

14:18 I will not leav you comfortless: I will come to you.

14:19 yet a littl while, and the world seeth me no more; but ye see
me: becaus I live, ye shall live also.

14:20 At that day ye shall know that I am in my father, and ye in me,
and I in you.

14:21 He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that
loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be love of my father, and i
wil love him, and will manifest myself to him.

14:22 juda saith unto him, not iscariot, lord, how is it that thou
wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?  14:23 jesus
answ and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my words:
and my father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our
abod with him.

14:24 He that loveth me not keepeth not my sayings: and the word which
y hear is not mine, but the father' which sent me.

14:25 these thing have I spoken unto you, be yet present with you.

14:26 but the comforter, which is the holi ghost, whom the father will
send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring all things
to your remembrance, whatsoev I have said unto you.

14:27 peac I leav with you, my peac I give unto you: not as the
world giveth, give I unto you. let not your heart be troubled, neither
let it be afraid.

14:28 Ye have heard how I said unto you, I go away, and come again
unto you. If ye love me, ye would rejoice, becaus I said, I go unto
th father: for my father is greater than i.

14:29 and now I have told you befor it come to pass, that, when it is
com to pass, ye might believe.

14:30 hereaft I will not talk much with you: for the princ of this
world cometh, and hath noth in me.

14:31 but that the world may know that I love the father; and as the
fath gave me commandment, even so I do. arise, let us go hence.

15:1 I am the true vine, and my father is the husbandman.

15:2 everi branch in me that beareth not fruit he taketh away: and
everi branch that beareth fruit, he purgeth it, that it may bring
forth more fruit.

15:3 now ye are clean through the word which I have spoken unto you.

15:4 abid in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of
itself, except it abid in the vine; no more can ye, except ye abide
in me.

15:5 I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and i
in him, the same bringeth forth much fruit: for without me ye can do
nothing.

15:6 If a man abid not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is
withered; and men gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they
ar burned.

15:7 If ye abid in me, and my word abid in you, ye shall ask what
y will, and it shall be done unto you.

15:8 herein is my father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; so shall
y be my disciples.

15:9 As the father hath love me, so have I love you: continu ye in
mi love.

15:10 If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abid in my love; even as i
hav kept my father' commandments, and abid in hi love.

15:11 these thing have I spoken unto you, that my joy might remain in
you, and that your joy might be full.

15:12 thi is my commandment, that ye love one another, as I have
lov you.

15:13 greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down hi life
for hi friends.

15:14 Ye are my friends, if ye do whatsoev I command you.

15:15 henceforth I call you not servants; for the servant knoweth not
what hi lord doeth: but I have call you friends; for all things
that I have heard of my father I have made known unto you.

15:16 Ye have not chosen me, but I have chosen you, and ordain you,
that ye should go and bring forth fruit, and that your fruit should
remain: that whatsoev ye shall ask of the father in my name, he may
giv it you.

15:17 these thing I command you, that ye love one another.

15:18 If the world hate you, ye know that it hate me befor it hated
you.

15:19 If ye were of the world, the world would love hi own: but
becaus ye are not of the world, but I have chosen you out of the
world, therefor the world hateth you.

15:20 rememb the word that I said unto you, the servant is not
great than hi lord. If they have persecut me, they will also
persecut you; if they have kept my saying, they will keep your also.

15:21 but all these thing will they do unto you for my name' sake,
becaus they know not him that sent me.

15:22 If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin:
but now they have no cloak for their sin.

15:23 He that hateth me hateth my father also.

15:24 If I had not done among them the work which none other man did,
they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hate both me
and my father.

15:25 but thi cometh to pass, that the word might be fulfil that
i written in their law, they hate me without a cause.

15:26 but when the comfort is come, whom I will send unto you from
th father, even the spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the
father, he shall testifi of me: 15:27 and ye also shall bear witness,
becaus ye have been with me from the beginning.

16:1 these thing have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be
offended.

16:2 they shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the time cometh,
that whosoev killeth you will think that he doeth god service.

16:3 and these thing will they do unto you, becaus they have not
known the father, nor me.

16:4 but these thing have I told you, that when the time shall come,
y may rememb that I told you of them. and these thing I said not
unto you at the beginning, becaus I wa with you.

16:5 but now I go my way to him that sent me; and none of you asketh
me, whither goest thou?  16:6 but becaus I have said these things
unto you, sorrow hath fill your heart.

16:7 nevertheless I tell you the truth; It is expedi for you that i
go away: for if I go not away, the comfort will not come unto you;
but if I depart, I will send him unto you.

16:8 and when he is come, he will reprov the world of sin, and of
righteousness, and of judgment: 16:9 Of sin, becaus they believ not
on me; 16:10 Of righteousness, becaus I go to my father, and ye see
m no more; 16:11 Of judgment, becaus the princ of thi world is
judged.

16:12 I have yet mani thing to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them
now.

16:13 howbeit when he, the spirit of truth, is come, he will guid you
into all truth: for he shall not speak of himself; but whatsoev he
shal hear, that shall he speak: and he will shew you thing to come.

16:14 He shall glorifi me: for he shall receiv of mine, and shall
shew it unto you.

16:15 all thing that the father hath are mine: therefor said I, that
h shall take of mine, and shall shew it unto you.

16:16 A littl while, and ye shall not see me: and again, a little
while, and ye shall see me, becaus I go to the father.

16:17 then said some of hi discipl among themselves, what is this
that he saith unto us, A littl while, and ye shall not see me: and
again, a littl while, and ye shall see me: and, becaus I go to the
father?  16:18 they said therefore, what is thi that he saith, a
littl while? we cannot tell what he saith.

16:19 now jesu knew that they were desir to ask him, and said unto
them, Do ye enquir among yourselv of that I said, A littl while,
and ye shall not see me: and again, a littl while, and ye shall see
me?  16:20 verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall weep and
lament, but the world shall rejoice: and ye shall be sorrowful, but
your sorrow shall be turn into joy.

16:21 A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, becaus her hour is
come: but as soon as she is deliv of the child, she remembereth no
mor the anguish, for joy that a man is born into the world.

16:22 and ye now therefor have sorrow: but I will see you again, and
your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no man taketh from you.

16:23 and in that day ye shall ask me nothing. verily, verily, I say
unto you, whatsoev ye shall ask the father in my name, he will give
it you.

16:24 hitherto have ye ask noth in my name: ask, and ye shall
receive, that your joy may be full.

16:25 these thing have I spoken unto you in proverbs: but the time
cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in proverbs, but I shall
shew you plainli of the father.

16:26 At that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you,
that I will pray the father for you: 16:27 for the father himself
loveth you, becaus ye have love me, and have believ that I came
out from god.

16:28 I came forth from the father, and am come into the world: again,
i leav the world, and go to the father.

16:29 hi discipl said unto him, lo, now speakest thou plainly, and
speakest no proverb.

16:30 now are we sure that thou knowest all things, and needest not
that ani man should ask thee: by thi we believ that thou camest
forth from god.

16:31 jesu answer them, Do ye now believe?  16:32 behold, the hour
cometh, yea, is now come, that ye shall be scattered, everi man to his
own, and shall leav me alone: and yet I am not alone, becaus the
fath is with me.

16:33 these thing I have spoken unto you, that in me ye might have
peace.

in the world ye shall have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have
overcom the world.

17:1 these word spake jesus, and lift up hi eye to heaven, and
said, father, the hour is come; glorifi thi son, that thi son also may
glorifi thee: 17:2 As thou hast given him power over all flesh, that
h should give etern life to as mani as thou hast given him.

17:3 and thi is life eternal, that they might know thee the onli true
god, and jesu christ, whom thou hast sent.

17:4 I have glorifi thee on the earth: I have finish the work
which thou gavest me to do.

17:5 and now, O father, glorifi thou me with thine own self with the
glori which I had with thee befor the world was.

17:6 I have manifest thi name unto the men which thou gavest me out
of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them me; and they have
kept thi word.

17:7 now they have known that all thing whatsoev thou hast given me
ar of thee.

17:8 for I have given unto them the word which thou gavest me; and
they have receiv them, and have known sure that I came out from
thee, and they have believ that thou didst send me.

17:9 I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for them which
thou hast given me; for they are thine.

17:10 and all mine are thine, and thine are mine; and I am glorified
in them.

17:11 and now I am no more in the world, but these are in the world,
and I come to thee. holi father, keep through thine own name those
whom thou hast given me, that they may be one, as we are.

17:12 while I wa with them in the world, I kept them in thi name:
thos that thou gavest me I have kept, and none of them is lost, but
th son of perdition; that the scriptur might be fulfilled.

17:13 and now come I to thee; and these thing I speak in the world,
that they might have my joy fulfil in themselves.

17:14 I have given them thi word; and the world hath hate them,
becaus they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

17:15 I pray not that thou shouldest take them out of the world, but
that thou shouldest keep them from the evil.

17:16 they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.

17:17 sanctifi them through thi truth: thi word is truth.

17:18 As thou hast sent me into the world, even so have I also sent
them into the world.

17:19 and for their sake I sanctifi myself, that they also might be
sanctifi through the truth.

17:20 neither pray I for these alone, but for them also which shall
believ on me through their word; 17:21 that they all may be one; as
thou, father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be one in
us: that the world may believ that thou hast sent me.

17:22 and the glori which thou gavest me I have given them; that they
may be one, even as we are one: 17:23 I in them, and thou in me, that
they may be made perfect in one; and that the world may know that thou
hast sent me, and hast love them, as thou hast love me.

17:24 father, I will that they also, whom thou hast given me, be with
m where I am; that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given
me: for thou lovedst me befor the foundat of the world.

17:25 O righteou father, the world hath not known thee: but I have
known thee, and these have known that thou hast sent me.

17:26 and I have declar unto them thi name, and will declar it:
that the love wherewith thou hast love me may be in them, and I in
them.

18:1 when jesu had spoken these words, he went forth with his
discipl over the brook cedron, where wa a garden, into the which he
entered, and hi disciples.

18:2 and juda also, which betray him, knew the place: for jesus
ofttim resort thither with hi disciples.

18:3 juda then, have receiv a band of men and offic from the
chief priest and pharisees, cometh thither with lantern and torches
and weapons.

18:4 jesu therefore, know all thing that should come upon him,
went forth, and said unto them, whom seek ye?  18:5 they answer him,
jesu of nazareth. jesu saith unto them, I am he.

and juda also, which betray him, stood with them.

18:6 As soon then as he had said unto them, I am he, they went
backward, and fell to the ground.

18:7 then ask he them again, whom seek ye? and they said, jesu of
nazareth.

18:8 jesu answered, I have told you that I am he: if therefor ye
seek me, let these go their way: 18:9 that the say might be
fulfilled, which he spake, Of them which thou gavest me have I lost
none.

18:10 then simon peter have a sword drew it, and smote the high
priest' servant, and cut off hi right ear. the servant' name was
malchus.

18:11 then said jesu unto peter, put up thi sword into the sheath:
th cup which my father hath given me, shall I not drink it?  18:12
then the band and the captain and offic of the jew took jesus, and
bound him, 18:13 and led him away to anna first; for he wa father in
law to caiaphas, which wa the high priest that same year.

18:14 now caiapha wa he, which gave counsel to the jews, that it was
expedi that one man should die for the people.

18:15 and simon peter follow jesus, and so did anoth disciple:
that discipl wa known unto the high priest, and went in with jesus
into the palac of the high priest.

18:16 but peter stood at the door without. then went out that other
disciple, which wa known unto the high priest, and spake unto her
that kept the door, and brought in peter.

18:17 then saith the damsel that kept the door unto peter, art not
thou also one of thi man' disciples? He saith, I am not.

18:18 and the servant and offic stood there, who had made a fire
of coals; for it wa cold: and they warm themselves: and peter stood
with them, and warm himself.

18:19 the high priest then ask jesu of hi disciples, and of his
doctrine.

18:20 jesu answer him, I spake openli to the world; I ever taught
in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither the jew alway resort;
and in secret have I said nothing.

18:21 whi askest thou me? ask them which heard me, what I have said
unto them: behold, they know what I said.

18:22 and when he had thu spoken, one of the offic which stood by
struck jesu with the palm of hi hand, saying, answerest thou the
high priest so?  18:23 jesu answer him, If I have spoken evil, bear
wit of the evil: but if well, whi smitest thou me?  18:24 now
anna had sent him bound unto caiapha the high priest.

18:25 and simon peter stood and warm himself. they said therefore
unto him, art not thou also one of hi disciples? He deni it, and
said, I am not.

18:26 one of the servant of the high priest, be hi kinsman whose
ear peter cut off, saith, did not I see thee in the garden with him?
18:27 peter then deni again: and immedi the cock crew.

18:28 then led they jesu from caiapha unto the hall of judgment: and
it wa early; and they themselv went not into the judgment hall,
lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.

18:29 pilat then went out unto them, and said, what accus bring
y against thi man?  18:30 they answer and said unto him, If he
wer not a malefactor, we would not have deliv him up unto thee.

18:31 then said pilat unto them, take ye him, and judg him according
to your law. the jew therefor said unto him, It is not law for us
to put ani man to death: 18:32 that the say of jesu might be
fulfilled, which he spake, signifi what death he should die.

18:33 then pilat enter into the judgment hall again, and called
jesus, and said unto him, art thou the king of the jews?  18:34 jesus
answ him, sayest thou thi thing of thyself, or did other tell it
the of me?  18:35 pilat answered, Am I a jew? thine own nation and
th chief priest have deliv thee unto me: what hast thou done?
18:36 jesu answered, My kingdom is not of thi world: if my kingdom
wer of thi world, then would my servant fight, that I should not be
deliv to the jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.

18:37 pilat therefor said unto him, art thou a king then? jesus
answered, thou sayest that I am a king. To thi end wa I born, and
for thi caus came I into the world, that I should bear wit unto
th truth. everi one that is of the truth heareth my voice.

18:38 pilat saith unto him, what is truth? and when he had said this,
h went out again unto the jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no
fault at all.

18:39 but ye have a custom, that I should releas unto you one at the
passover: will ye therefor that I releas unto you the king of the
jews?  18:40 then cri they all again, saying, not thi man, but
barabbas. now barabba wa a robber.

19:1 then pilat therefor took jesus, and scourg him.

19:2 and the soldier plat a crown of thorns, and put it on his
head, and they put on him a purpl robe, 19:3 and said, hail, king of
th jews! and they smote him with their hands.

19:4 pilat therefor went forth again, and saith unto them, behold, i
br him forth to you, that ye may know that I find no fault in him.

19:5 then came jesu forth, wear the crown of thorns, and the
purpl robe. and pilat saith unto them, behold the man!  19:6 when
th chief priest therefor and offic saw him, they cri out,
saying, crucifi him, crucifi him. pilat saith unto them, take ye him,
and crucifi him: for I find no fault in him.

19:7 the jew answer him, We have a law, and by our law he ought to
die, becaus he made himself the son of god.

19:8 when pilat therefor heard that saying, he wa the more afraid;
19:9 and went again into the judgment hall, and saith unto jesus,
wh art thou? but jesu gave him no answer.

19:10 then saith pilat unto him, speakest thou not unto me? knowest
th not that I have power to crucifi thee, and have power to release
thee?  19:11 jesu answered, thou couldest have no power at all
against me, except it were given thee from above: therefor he that
deliv me unto thee hath the greater sin.

19:12 and from thenceforth pilat sought to releas him: but the jews
cri out, saying, If thou let thi man go, thou art not caesar's
friend: whosoev maketh himself a king speaketh against caesar.

19:13 when pilat therefor heard that saying, he brought jesu forth,
and sat down in the judgment seat in a place that is call the
pavement, but in the hebrew, gabbatha.

19:14 and it wa the prepar of the passover, and about the sixth
hour: and he saith unto the jews, behold your king!  19:15 but they
cri out, away with him, away with him, crucifi him.

pil saith unto them, shall I crucifi your king? the chief priests
answered, We have no king but caesar.

19:16 then deliv he him therefor unto them to be crucified. and
they took jesus, and led him away.

19:17 and he bear hi cross went forth into a place call the
plac of a skull, which is call in the hebrew golgotha: 19:18 where
they crucifi him, and two other with him, on either side one, and
jesu in the midst.

19:19 and pilat wrote a title, and put it on the cross. and the
writ wa jesu OF nazareth the king OF the jews.

19:20 thi titl then read mani of the jews: for the place where jesus
wa crucifi wa nigh to the city: and it wa written in hebrew, and
greek, and latin.

19:21 then said the chief priest of the jew to pilate, write not,
th king of the jews; but that he said, I am king of the jews.

19:22 pilat answered, what I have written I have written.

19:23 then the soldiers, when they had crucifi jesus, took his
garments, and made four parts, to everi soldier a part; and also his
coat: now the coat wa without seam, woven from the top throughout.

19:24 they said therefor among themselves, let us not rend it, but
cast lot for it, whose it shall be: that the scriptur might be
fulfilled, which saith, they part my raiment among them, and for my
vestur they did cast lots. these thing therefor the soldier did.

19:25 now there stood by the cross of jesu hi mother, and his
mother' sister, mari the wife of cleophas, and mari magdalene.

19:26 when jesu therefor saw hi mother, and the discipl standing
by, whom he loved, he saith unto hi mother, woman, behold thi son!
19:27 then saith he to the disciple, behold thi mother! and from that
hour that discipl took her unto hi own home.

19:28 after this, jesu know that all thing were now accomplished,
that the scriptur might be fulfilled, saith, I thirst.

19:29 now there wa set a vessel full of vinegar: and they fill a
spung with vinegar, and put it upon hyssop, and put it to hi mouth.

19:30 when jesu therefor had receiv the vinegar, he said, It is
finished: and he bow hi head, and gave up the ghost.

19:31 the jew therefore, becaus it wa the preparation, that the
bodi should not remain upon the cross on the sabbath day, (for that
sabbath day wa an high day,) besought pilat that their leg might be
broken, and that they might be taken away.

19:32 then came the soldiers, and brake the leg of the first, and of
th other which wa crucifi with him.

19:33 but when they came to jesus, and saw that he wa dead already,
they brake not hi legs: 19:34 but one of the soldier with a spear
pierc hi side, and forthwith came there out blood and water.

19:35 and he that saw it bare record, and hi record is true: and he
knoweth that he saith true, that ye might believe.

19:36 for these thing were done, that the scriptur should be
fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.

19:37 and again anoth scriptur saith, they shall look on him whom
they pierced.

19:38 and after thi joseph of arimathaea, be a discipl of jesus,
but secretli for fear of the jews, besought pilat that he might take
away the bodi of jesus: and pilat gave him leave. He came therefore,
and took the bodi of jesus.

19:39 and there came also nicodemus, which at the first came to jesus
bi night, and brought a mixtur of myrrh and aloes, about an hundred
pound weight.

19:40 then took they the bodi of jesus, and wound it in linen clothes
with the spices, as the manner of the jew is to bury.

19:41 now in the place where he wa crucifi there wa a garden; and
in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein wa never man yet laid.

19:42 there laid they jesu therefor becaus of the jews' preparation
day; for the sepulchr wa nigh at hand.

20:1 the first day of the week cometh mari magdalen early, when it
wa yet dark, unto the sepulchre, and seeth the stone taken away from
th sepulchre.

20:2 then she runneth, and cometh to simon peter, and to the other
disciple, whom jesu loved, and saith unto them, they have taken away
th lord out of the sepulchre, and we know not where they have laid
him.

20:3 peter therefor went forth, and that other disciple, and came to
th sepulchre.

20:4 So they ran both together: and the other discipl did outrun
peter, and came first to the sepulchre.

20:5 and he stoop down, and look in, saw the linen clothes
lying; yet went he not in.

20:6 then cometh simon peter follow him, and went into the
sepulchre, and seeth the linen cloth lie, 20:7 and the napkin, that
wa about hi head, not lie with the linen clothes, but wrapped
togeth in a place by itself.

20:8 then went in also that other disciple, which came first to the
sepulchre, and he saw, and believed.

20:9 for as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again
from the dead.

20:10 then the discipl went away again unto their own home.

20:11 but mari stood without at the sepulchr weeping: and as she
wept, she stoop down, and look into the sepulchre, 20:12 and seeth
two angel in white sitting, the one at the head, and the other at the
feet, where the bodi of jesu had lain.

20:13 and they say unto her, woman, whi weepest thou? she saith unto
them, becaus they have taken away my lord, and I know not where they
hav laid him.

20:14 and when she had thu said, she turn herself back, and saw
jesu standing, and knew not that it wa jesus.

20:15 jesu saith unto her, woman, whi weepest thou? whom seekest
thou?  she, suppos him to be the gardener, saith unto him, sir, if
thou have born him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and i
wil take him away.

20:16 jesu saith unto her, mary. she turn herself, and saith unto
him, rabboni; which is to say, master.

20:17 jesu saith unto her, touch me not; for I am not yet ascend to
mi father: but go to my brethren, and say unto them, I ascend unto my
father, and your father; and to my god, and your god.

20:18 mari magdalen came and told the discipl that she had seen the
lord, and that he had spoken these thing unto her.

20:19 then the same day at evening, be the first day of the week,
when the door were shut where the discipl were assembl for fear
of the jews, came jesu and stood in the midst, and saith unto them,
peac be unto you.

20:20 and when he had so said, he shew unto them hi hand and his
side.

then were the discipl glad, when they saw the lord.

20:21 then said jesu to them again, peac be unto you: as my father
hath sent me, even so send I you.

20:22 and when he had said this, he breath on them, and saith unto
them, receiv ye the holi ghost: 20:23 whose soever sin ye remit,
they are remit unto them; and whose soever sin ye retain, they are
retained.

20:24 but thomas, one of the twelve, call didymus, wa not with them
when jesu came.

20:25 the other discipl therefor said unto him, We have seen the
lord.

but he said unto them, except I shall see in hi hand the print of
th nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust
mi hand into hi side, I will not believe.

20:26 and after eight day again hi discipl were within, and thomas
with them: then came jesus, the door be shut, and stood in the
midst, and said, peac be unto you.

20:27 then saith he to thomas, reach hither thi finger, and behold my
hands; and reach hither thi hand, and thrust it into my side: and be
not faithless, but believing.

20:28 and thoma answer and said unto him, My lord and my god.

20:29 jesu saith unto him, thomas, becaus thou hast seen me, thou
hast believed: bless are they that have not seen, and yet have
believed.

20:30 and mani other sign truli did jesu in the presenc of his
disciples, which are not written in thi book: 20:31 but these are
written, that ye might believ that jesu is the christ, the son of
god; and that believ ye might have life through hi name.

21:1 after these thing jesu shew himself again to the discipl at
th sea of tiberias; and on thi wise shew he himself.

21:2 there were togeth simon peter, and thoma call didymus, and
nathanael of cana in galilee, and the son of zebedee, and two other
of hi disciples.

21:3 simon peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. they say unto him,
w also go with thee. they went forth, and enter into a ship
immediately; and that night they caught nothing.

21:4 but when the morn wa now come, jesu stood on the shore: but
th discipl knew not that it wa jesus.

21:5 then jesu saith unto them, children, have ye ani meat? they
answ him, no.

21:6 and he said unto them, cast the net on the right side of the
ship, and ye shall find. they cast therefore, and now they were not
abl to draw it for the multitud of fishes.

21:7 therefor that discipl whom jesu love saith unto peter, It is
th lord. now when simon peter heard that it wa the lord, he girt his
fisher' coat unto him, (for he wa naked,) and did cast himself into
th sea.

21:8 and the other discipl came in a littl ship; (for they were not
far from land, but as it were two hundr cubits,) drag the net
with fishes.

21:9 As soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals
there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.

21:10 jesu saith unto them, bring of the fish which ye have now
caught.

21:11 simon peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great
fishes, an hundr and fifti and three: and for all there were so
many, yet wa not the net broken.

21:12 jesu saith unto them, come and dine. and none of the disciples
durst ask him, who art thou? know that it wa the lord.

21:13 jesu then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish
likewise.

21:14 thi is now the third time that jesu shew himself to his
disciples, after that he wa risen from the dead.

21:15 So when they had dined, jesu saith to simon peter, simon, son
of jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, yea,
lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, feed my lambs.

21:16 He saith to him again the second time, simon, son of jonas,
lovest thou me? He saith unto him, yea, lord; thou knowest that I love
thee. He saith unto him, feed my sheep.

21:17 He saith unto him the third time, simon, son of jonas, lovest
th me? peter wa griev becaus he said unto him the third time,
lovest thou me? and he said unto him, lord, thou knowest all things;
thou knowest that I love thee. jesu saith unto him, feed my sheep.

21:18 verily, verily, I say unto thee, when thou wast young, thou
girdest thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou
shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thi hands, and anoth shall
gird thee, and carri thee whither thou wouldest not.

21:19 thi spake he, signifi by what death he should glorifi god.
and when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, follow me.

21:20 then peter, turn about, seeth the discipl whom jesu loved
following; which also lean on hi breast at supper, and said, lord,
which is he that betrayeth thee?  21:21 peter see him saith to
jesus, lord, and what shall thi man do?  21:22 jesu saith unto him,
if I will that he tarri till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou
me.

21:23 then went thi say abroad among the brethren, that that
discipl should not die: yet jesu said not unto him, He shall not
die; but, If I will that he tarri till I come, what is that to thee?
21:24 thi is the discipl which testifieth of these things, and wrote
thes things: and we know that hi testimoni is true.

21:25 and there are also mani other thing which jesu did, the which,
if they should be written everi one, I suppos that even the world
itself could not contain the book that should be written. amen.




th act of the apostles


1:1 the former treatis have I made, O theophilus, of all that jesus
began both to do and teach, 1:2 until the day in which he wa taken
up, after that he through the holi ghost had given command unto
th apostl whom he had chosen: 1:3 To whom also he shew himself
al after hi passion by mani infal proofs, be seen of them
forti days, and speak of the thing pertain to the kingdom of
god: 1:4 and, be assembl togeth with them, command them that
they should not depart from jerusalem, but wait for the promis of the
father, which, saith he, ye have heard of me.

1:5 for john truli baptiz with water; but ye shall be baptiz with
th holi ghost not mani day hence.

1:6 when they therefor were come together, they ask of him, saying,
lord, wilt thou at thi time restor again the kingdom to israel?  1:7
and he said unto them, It is not for you to know the time or the
seasons, which the father hath put in hi own power.

1:8 but ye shall receiv power, after that the holi ghost is come upon
you: and ye shall be wit unto me both in jerusalem, and in all
judaea, and in samaria, and unto the uttermost part of the earth.

1:9 and when he had spoken these things, while they beheld, he was
taken up; and a cloud receiv him out of their sight.

1:10 and while they look stedfastli toward heaven as he went up,
behold, two men stood by them in white apparel; 1:11 which also said,
y men of galilee, whi stand ye gaze up into heaven? thi same
jesus, which is taken up from you into heaven, shall so come in like
mann as ye have seen him go into heaven.

1:12 then return they unto jerusalem from the mount call olivet,
which is from jerusalem a sabbath day' journey.

1:13 and when they were come in, they went up into an upper room,
wher abod both peter, and james, and john, and andrew, philip, and
thomas, bartholomew, and matthew, jame the son of alphaeus, and simon
zelotes, and juda the brother of james.

1:14 these all continu with one accord in prayer and supplication,
with the women, and mari the mother of jesus, and with hi brethren.

1:15 and in those day peter stood up in the midst of the disciples,
and said, (the number of name togeth were about an hundr and
twenty,) 1:16 men and brethren, thi scriptur must need have been
fulfilled, which the holi ghost by the mouth of david spake before
concern judas, which wa guid to them that took jesus.

1:17 for he wa number with us, and had obtain part of this
ministry.

1:18 now thi man purchas a field with the reward of iniquity; and
fal headlong, he burst asund in the midst, and all hi bowels
gush out.

1:19 and it wa known unto all the dweller at jerusalem; insomuch as
that field is call in their proper tongue, aceldama, that is to say,
th field of blood.

1:20 for it is written in the book of psalms, let hi habit be
desolate, and let no man dwell therein: and hi bishoprick let another
take.

1:21 wherefor of these men which have compani with us all the time
that the lord jesu went in and out among us, 1:22 begin from the
bapt of john, unto that same day that he wa taken up from us, must
on be ordain to be a wit with us of hi resurrection.

1:23 and they appoint two, joseph call barsabas, who wa surnamed
justus, and matthias.

1:24 and they prayed, and said, thou, lord, which knowest the hearts
of all men, shew whether of these two thou hast chosen, 1:25 that he
may take part of thi ministri and apostleship, from which juda by
transgress fell, that he might go to hi own place.

1:26 and they gave forth their lots; and the lot fell upon matthias;
and he wa number with the eleven apostles.

2:1 and when the day of pentecost wa fulli come, they were all with
on accord in one place.

2:2 and suddenli there came a sound from heaven as of a rush mighty
wind, and it fill all the hous where they were sitting.

2:3 and there appear unto them cloven tongu like as of fire, and
it sat upon each of them.

2:4 and they were all fill with the holi ghost, and began to speak
with other tongues, as the spirit gave them utterance.

2:5 and there were dwell at jerusalem jews, devout men, out of
everi nation under heaven.

2:6 now when thi wa nois abroad, the multitud came together, and
wer confounded, becaus that everi man heard them speak in hi own
language.

2:7 and they were all amaz and marvelled, say one to another,
behold, are not all these which speak galilaeans?  2:8 and how hear we
everi man in our own tongue, wherein we were born?  2:9 parthians, and
medes, and elamites, and the dweller in mesopotamia, and in judaea,
and cappadocia, in pontus, and asia, 2:10 phrygia, and pamphylia, in
egypt, and in the part of libya about cyrene, and stranger of rome,
jew and proselytes, 2:11 crete and arabians, we do hear them speak
in our tongu the wonder work of god.

2:12 and they were all amazed, and were in doubt, say one to
another, what meaneth this?  2:13 other mock said, these men are
ful of new wine.

2:14 but peter, stand up with the eleven, lift up hi voice, and
said unto them, Ye men of judaea, and all ye that dwell at jerusalem,
b thi known unto you, and hearken to my words: 2:15 for these are
not drunken, as ye suppose, see it is but the third hour of the
day.
