2:16 but thi is that which wa spoken by the prophet joel; 2:17 and
it shall come to pass in the last days, saith god, I will pour out of
mi spirit upon all flesh: and your son and your daughter shall
prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall
dream dreams: 2:18 and on my servant and on my handmaiden I will
pour out in those day of my spirit; and they shall prophesy: 2:19 and
i will shew wonder in heaven above, and sign in the earth beneath;
blood, and fire, and vapour of smoke: 2:20 the sun shall be turned
into darkness, and the moon into blood, befor the great and notable
day of the lord come: 2:21 and it shall come to pass, that whosoever
shal call on the name of the lord shall be saved.

2:22 Ye men of israel, hear these words; jesu of nazareth, a man
approv of god among you by miracl and wonder and signs, which god
did by him in the midst of you, as ye yourselv also know: 2:23 him,
b deliv by the determin counsel and foreknowledg of god,
y have taken, and by wick hand have crucifi and slain: 2:24 whom
god hath rais up, have loos the pain of death: becaus it was
not possibl that he should be holden of it.

2:25 for david speaketh concern him, I foresaw the lord always
befor my face, for he is on my right hand, that I should not be
moved: 2:26 therefor did my heart rejoice, and my tongu wa glad;
moreov also my flesh shall rest in hope: 2:27 becaus thou wilt not
leav my soul in hell, neither wilt thou suffer thine holi one to see
corruption.

2:28 thou hast made known to me the way of life; thou shalt make me
ful of joy with thi countenance.

2:29 men and brethren, let me freeli speak unto you of the patriarch
david, that he is both dead and buried, and hi sepulchr is with us
unto thi day.

2:30 therefor be a prophet, and know that god had sworn with an
oath to him, that of the fruit of hi loins, accord to the flesh,
h would rais up christ to sit on hi throne; 2:31 He see this
befor spake of the resurrect of christ, that hi soul wa not left
in hell, neither hi flesh did see corruption.

2:32 thi jesu hath god rais up, whereof we all are witnesses.

2:33 therefor be by the right hand of god exalted, and having
receiv of the father the promis of the holi ghost, he hath shed
forth this, which ye now see and hear.

2:34 for david is not ascend into the heavens: but he saith himself,
th lord said unto my lord, sit thou on my right hand, 2:35 until i
mak thi foe thi footstool.

2:36 therefor let all the hous of israel know assuredly, that god
hath made the same jesus, whom ye have crucified, both lord and
christ.

2:37 now when they heard this, they were prick in their heart, and
said unto peter and to the rest of the apostles, men and brethren,
what shall we do?  2:38 then peter said unto them, repent, and be
bapt everi one of you in the name of jesu christ for the
remiss of sins, and ye shall receiv the gift of the holi ghost.

2:39 for the promis is unto you, and to your children, and to all
that are afar off, even as mani as the lord our god shall call.

2:40 and with mani other word did he testifi and exhort, saying, save
yourselv from thi untoward generation.

2:41 then they that gladli receiv hi word were baptized: and the
sam day there were ad unto them about three thousand souls.

2:42 and they continu stedfastli in the apostles' doctrin and
fellowship, and in break of bread, and in prayers.

2:43 and fear came upon everi soul: and mani wonder and sign were
don by the apostles.

2:44 and all that believ were together, and had all thing common;
2:45 and sold their possess and goods, and part them to all men,
a everi man had need.

2:46 and they, continu daili with one accord in the temple, and
break bread from hous to house, did eat their meat with gladness
and singl of heart, 2:47 prais god, and have favour with all
th people. and the lord ad to the church daili such as should be
saved.

3:1 now peter and john went up togeth into the templ at the hour of
prayer, be the ninth hour.

3:2 and a certain man lame from hi mother' womb wa carried, whom
they laid daili at the gate of the templ which is call beautiful,
to ask alm of them that enter into the temple; 3:3 who see peter
and john about to go into the templ ask an alms.

3:4 and peter, fasten hi eye upon him with john, said, look on
us.

3:5 and he gave heed unto them, expect to receiv someth of
them.

3:6 then peter said, silver and gold have I none; but such as I have
g I thee: In the name of jesu christ of nazareth rise up and walk.

3:7 and he took him by the right hand, and lift him up: and
immedi hi feet and ankl bone receiv strength.

3:8 and he leap up stood, and walked, and enter with them into
th temple, walking, and leaping, and prais god.

3:9 and all the peopl saw him walk and prais god: 3:10 and they
knew that it wa he which sat for alm at the beauti gate of the
temple: and they were fill with wonder and amaz at that which
had happen unto him.

3:11 and as the lame man which wa heal held peter and john, all the
peopl ran togeth unto them in the porch that is call solomon's,
greatli wondering.

3:12 and when peter saw it, he answer unto the people, Ye men of
israel, whi marvel ye at this? or whi look ye so earnestli on us, as
though by our own power or holi we had made thi man to walk?
3:13 the god of abraham, and of isaac, and of jacob, the god of our
fathers, hath glorifi hi son jesus; whom ye deliv up, and
deni him in the presenc of pilate, when he wa determin to let
him go.

3:14 but ye deni the holi one and the just, and desir a murderer
to be grant unto you; 3:15 and kill the princ of life, whom god
hath rais from the dead; whereof we are witnesses.

3:16 and hi name through faith in hi name hath made thi man strong,
whom ye see and know: yea, the faith which is by him hath given him
thi perfect sound in the presenc of you all.

3:17 and now, brethren, I wot that through ignor ye did it, as did
also your rulers.

3:18 but those things, which god befor had shew by the mouth of all
hi prophets, that christ should suffer, he hath so fulfilled.

3:19 repent ye therefore, and be converted, that your sin may be
blot out, when the time of refresh shall come from the presence
of the lord.

3:20 and he shall send jesu christ, which befor wa preach unto
you: 3:21 whom the heaven must receiv until the time of restitution
of all things, which god hath spoken by the mouth of all hi holy
prophet sinc the world began.

3:22 for mose truli said unto the fathers, A prophet shall the lord
your god rais up unto you of your brethren, like unto me; him shall
y hear in all thing whatsoev he shall say unto you.

3:23 and it shall come to pass, that everi soul, which will not hear
that prophet, shall be destroy from among the people.

3:24 yea, and all the prophet from samuel and those that follow
after, as mani as have spoken, have likewis foretold of these days.

3:25 Ye are the children of the prophets, and of the coven which
god made with our fathers, say unto abraham, and in thi seed shall
al the kindr of the earth be blessed.

3:26 unto you first god, have rais up hi son jesus, sent him to
bless you, in turn away everi one of you from hi iniquities.

4:1 and as they spake unto the people, the priests, and the captain of
th temple, and the sadducees, came upon them, 4:2 be griev that
they taught the people, and preach through jesu the resurrection
from the dead.

4:3 and they laid hand on them, and put them in hold unto the next
day: for it wa now eventide.

4:4 howbeit mani of them which heard the word believed; and the number
of the men wa about five thousand.

4:5 and it came to pass on the morrow, that their rulers, and elders,
and scribes, 4:6 and anna the high priest, and caiaphas, and john,
and alexander, and as mani as were of the kindr of the high priest,
wer gather togeth at jerusalem.

4:7 and when they had set them in the midst, they asked, By what
power, or by what name, have ye done this?  4:8 then peter, filled
with the holi ghost, said unto them, Ye ruler of the people, and
eld of israel, 4:9 If we thi day be examin of the good deed done
to the impot man, by what mean he is made whole; 4:10 Be it known
unto you all, and to all the peopl of israel, that by the name of
jesu christ of nazareth, whom ye crucified, whom god rais from the
dead, even by him doth thi man stand here befor you whole.

4:11 thi is the stone which wa set at nought of you builders, which
i becom the head of the corner.

4:12 neither is there salvat in ani other: for there is none other
nam under heaven given among men, wherebi we must be saved.

4:13 now when they saw the bold of peter and john, and perceived
that they were unlearn and ignor men, they marvelled; and they
took knowledg of them, that they had been with jesus.

4:14 and behold the man which wa heal stand with them, they
could say noth against it.

4:15 but when they had command them to go asid out of the council,
they confer among themselves, 4:16 saying, what shall we do to
thes men? for that inde a notabl miracl hath been done by them is
manifest to all them that dwell in jerusalem; and we cannot deni it.

4:17 but that it spread no further among the people, let us straitly
threaten them, that they speak henceforth to no man in thi name.

4:18 and they call them, and command them not to speak at all nor
teach in the name of jesus.

4:19 but peter and john answer and said unto them, whether it be
right in the sight of god to hearken unto you more than unto god,
judg ye.

4:20 for we cannot but speak the thing which we have seen and heard.

4:21 So when they had further threaten them, they let them go,
find noth how they might punish them, becaus of the people: for
al men glorifi god for that which wa done.

4:22 for the man wa abov forti year old, on whom thi miracl of
heal wa shewed.

4:23 and be let go, they went to their own company, and reported
al that the chief priest and elder had said unto them.

4:24 and when they heard that, they lift up their voic to god with
on accord, and said, lord, thou art god, which hast made heaven, and
earth, and the sea, and all that in them is: 4:25 who by the mouth of
thi servant david hast said, whi did the heathen rage, and the people
imagin vain things?  4:26 the king of the earth stood up, and the
rul were gather togeth against the lord, and against his
christ.

4:27 for of a truth against thi holi child jesus, whom thou hast
anointed, both herod, and pontiu pilate, with the gentiles, and the
peopl of israel, were gather together, 4:28 for to do whatsoever
thi hand and thi counsel determin befor to be done.

4:29 and now, lord, behold their threatenings: and grant unto thy
servants, that with all bold they may speak thi word, 4:30 by
stretch forth thine hand to heal; and that sign and wonder may be
don by the name of thi holi child jesus.

4:31 and when they had prayed, the place wa shaken where they were
assembl together; and they were all fill with the holi ghost, and
they spake the word of god with boldness.

4:32 and the multitud of them that believ were of one heart and of
on soul: neither said ani of them that ought of the thing which he
possess wa hi own; but they had all thing common.

4:33 and with great power gave the apostl wit of the
resurrect of the lord jesus: and great grace wa upon them all.

4:34 neither wa there ani among them that lacked: for as mani as were
possessor of land or hous sold them, and brought the price of the
th that were sold, 4:35 and laid them down at the apostles' feet:
and distribut wa made unto everi man accord as he had need.

4:36 and joses, who by the apostl wa surnam barnabas, (which is,
b interpreted, the son of consolation,) a levite, and of the
countri of cyprus, 4:37 have land, sold it, and brought the money,
and laid it at the apostles' feet.

5:1 but a certain man name ananias, with sapphira hi wife, sold a
possession, 5:2 and kept back part of the price, hi wife also being
privi to it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles'
feet.

5:3 but peter said, ananias, whi hath satan fill thine heart to lie
to the holi ghost, and to keep back part of the price of the land?
5:4 while it remained, wa it not thine own? and after it wa sold,
wa it not in thine own power? whi hast thou conceiv thi thing in
thin heart?  thou hast not lie unto men, but unto god.

5:5 and anania hear these word fell down, and gave up the ghost:
and great fear came on all them that heard these things.

5:6 and the young men arose, wound him up, and carri him out, and
buri him.

5:7 and it wa about the space of three hour after, when hi wife,
not know what wa done, came in.

5:8 and peter answer unto her, tell me whether ye sold the land for
so much? and she said, yea, for so much.

5:9 then peter said unto her, how is it that ye have agre together
to tempt the spirit of the lord? behold, the feet of them which have
buri thi husband are at the door, and shall carri thee out.

5:10 then fell she down straightway at hi feet, and yield up the
ghost: and the young men came in, and found her dead, and, carrying
h forth, buri her by her husband.

5:11 and great fear came upon all the church, and upon as mani as
heard these things.

5:12 and by the hand of the apostl were mani sign and wonders
wrought among the people; (and they were all with one accord in
solomon' porch.

5:13 and of the rest durst no man join himself to them: but the people
magnifi them.

5:14 and believ were the more ad to the lord, multitud both of
men and women.)  5:15 insomuch that they brought forth the sick into
th streets, and laid them on bed and couches, that at the least the
shadow of peter pass by might overshadow some of them.

5:16 there came also a multitud out of the citi round about unto
jerusalem, bring sick folks, and them which were vex with unclean
spirits: and they were heal everi one.

5:17 then the high priest rose up, and all they that were with him,
(which is the sect of the sadducees,) and were fill with
indignation, 5:18 and laid their hand on the apostles, and put them
in the common prison.

5:19 but the angel of the lord by night open the prison doors, and
brought them forth, and said, 5:20 go, stand and speak in the temple
to the peopl all the word of thi life.

5:21 and when they heard that, they enter into the templ earli in
th morning, and taught. but the high priest came, and they that were
with him, and call the council together, and all the senat of the
children of israel, and sent to the prison to have them brought.

5:22 but when the offic came, and found them not in the prison,
they return and told, 5:23 saying, the prison truli found we shut
with all safety, and the keeper stand without befor the doors:
but when we had opened, we found no man within.

5:24 now when the high priest and the captain of the templ and the
chief priest heard these things, they doubt of them whereunto this
would grow.

5:25 then came one and told them, saying, behold, the men whom ye put
in prison are stand in the temple, and teach the people.

5:26 then went the captain with the officers, and brought them without
violence: for they fear the people, lest they should have been
stoned.

5:27 and when they had brought them, they set them befor the council:
and the high priest ask them, 5:28 saying, did not we straitly
command you that ye should not teach in thi name? and, behold, ye
hav fill jerusalem with your doctrine, and intend to bring this
man' blood upon us.

5:29 then peter and the other apostl answer and said, We ought to
obey god rather than men.

5:30 the god of our father rais up jesus, whom ye slew and hanged
on a tree.

5:31 him hath god exalt with hi right hand to be a princ and a
saviour, for to give repent to israel, and forgiv of sins.

5:32 and we are hi wit of these things; and so is also the holy
ghost, whom god hath given to them that obey him.

5:33 when they heard that, they were cut to the heart, and took
counsel to slay them.

5:34 then stood there up one in the council, a pharisee, named
gamaliel, a doctor of the law, had in reput among all the people,
and command to put the apostl forth a littl space; 5:35 and said
unto them, Ye men of israel, take heed to yourselv what ye intend to
do as touch these men.

5:36 for befor these day rose up theudas, boast himself to be
somebody; to whom a number of men, about four hundred, joined
themselves: who wa slain; and all, as mani as obey him, were
scattered, and brought to nought.

5:37 after thi man rose up juda of galile in the day of the
taxing, and drew away much peopl after him: he also perished; and
all, even as mani as obey him, were dispersed.

5:38 and now I say unto you, refrain from these men, and let them
alone: for if thi counsel or thi work be of men, it will come to
nought: 5:39 but if it be of god, ye cannot overthrow it; lest haply
y be found even to fight against god.

5:40 and to him they agreed: and when they had call the apostles,
and beaten them, they command that they should not speak in the name
of jesus, and let them go.

5:41 and they depart from the presenc of the council, rejoicing
that they were count worthi to suffer shame for hi name.

5:42 and daili in the temple, and in everi house, they ceas not to
teach and preach jesu christ.

6:1 and in those days, when the number of the discipl was
multiplied, there aros a murmur of the grecian against the
hebrews, becaus their widow were neglect in the daily
ministration.

6:2 then the twelv call the multitud of the discipl unto them,
and said, It is not reason that we should leav the word of god, and
serv tables.

6:3 wherefore, brethren, look ye out among you seven men of honest
report, full of the holi ghost and wisdom, whom we may appoint over
thi business.

6:4 but we will give ourselv continu to prayer, and to the
ministri of the word.

6:5 and the say pleas the whole multitude: and they chose
stephen, a man full of faith and of the holi ghost, and philip, and
prochorus, and nicanor, and timon, and parmenas, and nicola a
proselyt of antioch: 6:6 whom they set befor the apostles: and when
they had prayed, they laid their hand on them.

6:7 and the word of god increased; and the number of the disciples
multipli in jerusalem greatly; and a great compani of the priests
wer obedi to the faith.

6:8 and stephen, full of faith and power, did great wonder and
miracl among the people.

6:9 then there aros certain of the synagogue, which is call the
synagogu of the libertines, and cyrenians, and alexandrians, and of
them of cilicia and of asia, disput with stephen.

6:10 and they were not abl to resist the wisdom and the spirit by
which he spake.

6:11 then they suborn men, which said, We have heard him speak
blasphem word against moses, and against god.

6:12 and they stir up the people, and the elders, and the scribes,
and came upon him, and caught him, and brought him to the council,
6:13 and set up fals witnesses, which said, thi man ceaseth not to
speak blasphem word against thi holi place, and the law: 6:14 for
w have heard him say, that thi jesu of nazareth shall destroy this
place, and shall chang the custom which mose deliv us.

6:15 and all that sat in the council, look stedfastli on him, saw
hi face as it had been the face of an angel.

7:1 then said the high priest, are these thing so?  7:2 and he said,
men, brethren, and fathers, hearken; the god of glori appear unto
our father abraham, when he wa in mesopotamia, befor he dwelt in
charran, 7:3 and said unto him, get thee out of thi country, and from
thi kindred, and come into the land which I shall shew thee.

7:4 then came he out of the land of the chaldaeans, and dwelt in
charran: and from thence, when hi father wa dead, he remov him
into thi land, wherein ye now dwell.

7:5 and he gave him none inherit in it, no, not so much as to set
hi foot on: yet he promis that he would give it to him for a
possession, and to hi seed after him, when as yet he had no child.

7:6 and god spake on thi wise, that hi seed should sojourn in a
strang land; and that they should bring them into bondage, and
entreat them evil four hundr years.

7:7 and the nation to whom they shall be in bondag will I judge, said
god: and after that shall they come forth, and serv me in thi place.

7:8 and he gave him the coven of circumcision: and so abraham begat
isaac, and circumcis him the eighth day; and isaac begat jacob; and
jacob begat the twelv patriarchs.

7:9 and the patriarchs, move with envy, sold joseph into egypt: but
god wa with him, 7:10 and deliv him out of all hi afflictions,
and gave him favour and wisdom in the sight of pharaoh king of egypt;
and he made him governor over egypt and all hi house.

7:11 now there came a dearth over all the land of egypt and chanaan,
and great affliction: and our father found no sustenance.

7:12 but when jacob heard that there wa corn in egypt, he sent out
our father first.

7:13 and at the second time joseph wa made known to hi brethren; and
joseph' kindr wa made known unto pharaoh.

7:14 then sent joseph, and call hi father jacob to him, and all his
kindred, threescor and fifteen souls.

7:15 So jacob went down into egypt, and died, he, and our fathers,
7:16 and were carri over into sychem, and laid in the sepulchr that
abraham bought for a sum of money of the son of emmor the father of
sychem.

7:17 but when the time of the promis drew nigh, which god had sworn
to abraham, the peopl grew and multipli in egypt, 7:18 till another
k arose, which knew not joseph.

7:19 the same dealt subtilli with our kindred, and evil entreat our
fathers, so that they cast out their young children, to the end they
might not live.

7:20 In which time mose wa born, and wa exceed fair, and
nourish up in hi father' hous three months: 7:21 and when he was
cast out, pharaoh' daughter took him up, and nourish him for her
own son.

7:22 and mose wa learn in all the wisdom of the egyptians, and was
mighti in word and in deeds.

7:23 and when he wa full forti year old, it came into hi heart to
visit hi brethren the children of israel.

7:24 and see one of them suffer wrong, he defend him, and avenged
him that wa oppressed, and smote the egyptian: 7:25 for he supposed
hi brethren would have understood how that god by hi hand would
deliv them: but they understood not.

7:26 and the next day he shew himself unto them as they strove, and
would have set them at one again, saying, sirs, ye are brethren; why
do ye wrong one to another?  7:27 but he that did hi neighbour wrong
thrust him away, saying, who made thee a ruler and a judg over us?
7:28 wilt thou kill me, as thou diddest the egyptian yesterday?  7:29
then fled mose at thi saying, and wa a stranger in the land of
madian, where he begat two sons.

7:30 and when forti year were expired, there appear to him in the
wild of mount sina an angel of the lord in a flame of fire in a
bush.

7:31 when mose saw it, he wonder at the sight: and as he drew near
to behold it, the voic of the lord came unto him, 7:32 saying, I am
th god of thi fathers, the god of abraham, and the god of isaac, and
th god of jacob. then mose trembled, and durst not behold.

7:33 then said the lord to him, put off thi shoe from thi feet: for
th place where thou standest is holi ground.

7:34 I have seen, I have seen the afflict of my peopl which is in
egypt, and I have heard their groaning, and am come down to deliver
them. and now come, I will send thee into egypt.

7:35 thi mose whom they refused, saying, who made thee a ruler and a
judge? the same did god send to be a ruler and a deliver by the hand
of the angel which appear to him in the bush.

7:36 He brought them out, after that he had shew wonder and signs
in the land of egypt, and in the red sea, and in the wilder forty
years.

7:37 thi is that moses, which said unto the children of israel, a
prophet shall the lord your god rais up unto you of your brethren,
lik unto me; him shall ye hear.

7:38 thi is he, that wa in the church in the wilder with the
angel which spake to him in the mount sina, and with our fathers: who
receiv the live oracl to give unto us: 7:39 To whom our fathers
would not obey, but thrust him from them, and in their heart turned
back again into egypt, 7:40 say unto aaron, make us god to go
befor us: for as for thi moses, which brought us out of the land of
egypt, we wot not what is becom of him.

7:41 and they made a calf in those days, and offer sacrific unto
th idol, and rejoic in the work of their own hands.

7:42 then god turned, and gave them up to worship the host of heaven;
a it is written in the book of the prophets, O ye hous of israel,
hav ye offer to me slain beast and sacrific by the space of
forti year in the wilderness?  7:43 yea, ye took up the tabernacl of
moloch, and the star of your god remphan, figur which ye made to
worship them: and I will carri you away beyond babylon.

7:44 our father had the tabernacl of wit in the wilderness, as
h had appointed, speak unto moses, that he should make it
accord to the fashion that he had seen.

7:45 which also our father that came after brought in with jesu into
th possess of the gentiles, whom god drave out befor the face of
our fathers, unto the day of david; 7:46 who found favour befor god,
and desir to find a tabernacl for the god of jacob.

7:47 but solomon built him an house.

7:48 howbeit the most high dwelleth not in templ made with hands; as
saith the prophet, 7:49 heaven is my throne, and earth is my
footstool: what hous will ye build me? saith the lord: or what is the
plac of my rest?  7:50 hath not my hand made all these things?  7:51
ye stiffneck and uncircumcis in heart and ears, ye do always
resist the holi ghost: as your father did, so do ye.

7:52 which of the prophet have not your father persecuted? and they
hav slain them which shew befor of the come of the just one; of
whom ye have been now the betray and murderers: 7:53 who have
receiv the law by the disposit of angels, and have not kept it.

7:54 when they heard these things, they were cut to the heart, and
they gnash on him with their teeth.

7:55 but he, be full of the holi ghost, look up stedfastli into
heaven, and saw the glori of god, and jesu stand on the right hand
of god, 7:56 and said, behold, I see the heaven opened, and the son
of man stand on the right hand of god.

7:57 then they cri out with a loud voice, and stop their ears,
and ran upon him with one accord, 7:58 and cast him out of the city,
and stone him: and the wit laid down their cloth at a young
man' feet, whose name wa saul.

7:59 and they stone stephen, call upon god, and saying, lord
jesus, receiv my spirit.

7:60 and he kneel down, and cri with a loud voice, lord, lay not
thi sin to their charge. and when he had said this, he fell asleep.

8:1 and saul wa consent unto hi death. and at that time there was
a great persecut against the church which wa at jerusalem; and
they were all scatter abroad throughout the region of judaea and
samaria, except the apostles.

8:2 and devout men carri stephen to hi burial, and made great
lament over him.

8:3 As for saul, he made havock of the church, enter into every
house, and hale men and women commit them to prison.

8:4 therefor they that were scatter abroad went everi where
preach the word.

8:5 then philip went down to the citi of samaria, and preach christ
unto them.

8:6 and the peopl with one accord gave heed unto those thing which
philip spake, hear and see the miracl which he did.

8:7 for unclean spirits, cri with loud voice, came out of mani that
wer possess with them: and mani taken with palsies, and that were
lame, were healed.

8:8 and there wa great joy in that city.

8:9 but there wa a certain man, call simon, which beforetim in the
sam citi use sorcery, and bewitch the peopl of samaria, giving
out that himself wa some great one: 8:10 To whom they all gave heed,
from the least to the greatest, saying, thi man is the great power of
god.

8:11 and to him they had regard, becaus that of long time he had
bewitch them with sorceries.

8:12 but when they believ philip preach the thing concern the
kingdom of god, and the name of jesu christ, they were baptized, both
men and women.

8:13 then simon himself believ also: and when he wa baptized, he
continu with philip, and wondered, behold the miracl and signs
which were done.

8:14 now when the apostl which were at jerusalem heard that samaria
had receiv the word of god, they sent unto them peter and john: 8:15
who, when they were come down, pray for them, that they might
rec the holi ghost: 8:16 (for as yet he wa fallen upon none of
them: onli they were baptiz in the name of the lord jesus.)  8:17
then laid they their hand on them, and they receiv the holi ghost.

8:18 and when simon saw that through lay on of the apostles' hands
th holi ghost wa given, he offer them money, 8:19 saying, give me
also thi power, that on whomsoev I lay hands, he may receiv the
holi ghost.

8:20 but peter said unto him, thi money perish with thee, becaus thou
hast thought that the gift of god may be purchas with money.

8:21 thou hast neither part nor lot in thi matter: for thi heart is
not right in the sight of god.

8:22 repent therefor of thi thi wickedness, and pray god, if perhaps
th thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.

8:23 for I perceiv that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in
th bond of iniquity.

8:24 then answer simon, and said, pray ye to the lord for me, that
non of these thing which ye have spoken come upon me.

8:25 and they, when they had testifi and preach the word of the
lord, return to jerusalem, and preach the gospel in mani villages
of the samaritans.

8:26 and the angel of the lord spake unto philip, saying, arise, and
go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from jerusalem unto
gaza, which is desert.

8:27 and he aros and went: and, behold, a man of ethiopia, an eunuch
of great author under candac queen of the ethiopians, who had the
charg of all her treasure, and had come to jerusalem for to worship,
8:28 wa returning, and sit in hi chariot read esaia the
prophet.

8:29 then the spirit said unto philip, Go near, and join thyself to
thi chariot.

8:30 and philip ran thither to him, and heard him read the prophet
esaias, and said, understandest thou what thou readest?  8:31 and he
said, how can I, except some man should guid me? and he desired
philip that he would come up and sit with him.

8:32 the place of the scriptur which he read wa this, He wa led as
a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb befor hi shearer, so
open he not hi mouth: 8:33 In hi humili hi judgment was
taken away: and who shall declar hi generation? for hi life is
taken from the earth.

8:34 and the eunuch answer philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom
speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?  8:35
then philip open hi mouth, and began at the same scripture, and
preach unto him jesus.

8:36 and as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water:
and the eunuch said, see, here is water; what doth hinder me to be
baptized?  8:37 and philip said, If thou believest with all thine
heart, thou mayest.

and he answer and said, I believ that jesu christ is the son of
god.

8:38 and he command the chariot to stand still: and they went down
both into the water, both philip and the eunuch; and he baptiz him.

8:39 and when they were come up out of the water, the spirit of the
lord caught away philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went
on hi way rejoicing.

8:40 but philip wa found at azotus: and pass through he preached
in all the cities, till he came to caesarea.

9:1 and saul, yet breath out threaten and slaughter against the
discipl of the lord, went unto the high priest, 9:2 and desir of
him letter to damascu to the synagogues, that if he found ani of
thi way, whether they were men or women, he might bring them bound
unto jerusalem.

9:3 and as he journeyed, he came near damascus: and suddenli there
shin round about him a light from heaven: 9:4 and he fell to the
earth, and heard a voic say unto him, saul, saul, whi persecutest
th me?  9:5 and he said, who art thou, lord? and the lord said, I am
jesu whom thou persecutest: it is hard for thee to kick against the
pricks.

9:6 and he trembl and astonish said, lord, what wilt thou have me
to do? and the lord said unto him, arise, and go into the city, and it
shal be told thee what thou must do.

9:7 and the men which journey with him stood speechless, hear a
voice, but see no man.

9:8 and saul aros from the earth; and when hi eye were opened, he
saw no man: but they led him by the hand, and brought him into
damascus.

9:9 and he wa three day without sight, and neither did eat nor
drink.

9:10 and there wa a certain discipl at damascus, name ananias; and
to him said the lord in a vision, ananias. and he said, behold, I am
here, lord.

9:11 and the lord said unto him, arise, and go into the street which
i call straight, and enquir in the hous of juda for one called
saul, of tarsus: for, behold, he prayeth, 9:12 and hath seen in a
vis a man name anania come in, and put hi hand on him,
that he might receiv hi sight.

9:13 then anania answered, lord, I have heard by mani of thi man,
how much evil he hath done to thi saint at jerusalem: 9:14 and here
h hath author from the chief priest to bind all that call on thy
name.

9:15 but the lord said unto him, Go thi way: for he is a chosen vessel
unto me, to bear my name befor the gentiles, and kings, and the
children of israel: 9:16 for I will shew him how great thing he must
suff for my name' sake.

9:17 and anania went hi way, and enter into the house; and putting
hi hand on him said, brother saul, the lord, even jesus, that
appear unto thee in the way as thou camest, hath sent me, that thou
mightest receiv thi sight, and be fill with the holi ghost.

9:18 and immedi there fell from hi eye as it had been scales:
and he receiv sight forthwith, and arose, and wa baptized.

9:19 and when he had receiv meat, he wa strengthened. then wa saul
certain day with the discipl which were at damascus.

9:20 and straightway he preach christ in the synagogues, that he is
th son of god.

9:21 but all that heard him were amazed, and said; Is not thi he that
destroy them which call on thi name in jerusalem, and came hither
for that intent, that he might bring them bound unto the chief
priests?  9:22 but saul increas the more in strength, and confounded
th jew which dwelt at damascus, prove that thi is veri christ.

9:23 and after that mani day were fulfilled, the jew took counsel to
kil him: 9:24 but their lay await wa known of saul. and they
watch the gate day and night to kill him.

9:25 then the discipl took him by night, and let him down by the
wal in a basket.

9:26 and when saul wa come to jerusalem, he assay to join himself
to the disciples: but they were all afraid of him, and believ not
that he wa a disciple.

9:27 but barnaba took him, and brought him to the apostles, and
declar unto them how he had seen the lord in the way, and that he
had spoken to him, and how he had preach boldli at damascu in the
nam of jesus.

9:28 and he wa with them come in and go out at jerusalem.

9:29 and he spake boldli in the name of the lord jesus, and disputed
against the grecians: but they went about to slay him.

9:30 which when the brethren knew, they brought him down to caesarea,
and sent him forth to tarsus.

9:31 then had the church rest throughout all judaea and galile and
samaria, and were edified; and walk in the fear of the lord, and in
th comfort of the holi ghost, were multiplied.

9:32 and it came to pass, as peter pass throughout all quarters, he
cam down also to the saint which dwelt at lydda.

9:33 and there he found a certain man name aeneas, which had kept his
b eight years, and wa sick of the palsy.

9:34 and peter said unto him, aeneas, jesu christ maketh thee whole:
arise, and make thi bed. and he aros immediately.

9:35 and all that dwelt at lydda and saron saw him, and turn to the
lord.

9:36 now there wa at joppa a certain discipl name tabitha, which by
interpret is call dorcas: thi woman wa full of good work and
almsde which she did.

9:37 and it came to pass in those days, that she wa sick, and died:
whom when they had washed, they laid her in an upper chamber.

9:38 and forasmuch as lydda wa nigh to joppa, and the discipl had
heard that peter wa there, they sent unto him two men, desir him
that he would not delay to come to them.

9:39 then peter aros and went with them. when he wa come, they
brought him into the upper chamber: and all the widow stood by him
weeping, and shew the coat and garment which dorca made, while
sh wa with them.

9:40 but peter put them all forth, and kneel down, and prayed; and
turn him to the bodi said, tabitha, arise. and she open her eyes:
and when she saw peter, she sat up.

9:41 and he gave her hi hand, and lift her up, and when he had
cal the saint and widows, present her alive.

9:42 and it wa known throughout all joppa; and mani believ in the
lord.

9:43 and it came to pass, that he tarri mani day in joppa with one
simon a tanner.

10:1 there wa a certain man in caesarea call cornelius, a centurion
of the band call the italian band, 10:2 A devout man, and one that
fear god with all hi house, which gave much alm to the people, and
pray to god alway.

10:3 He saw in a vision evid about the ninth hour of the day an
angel of god come in to him, and say unto him, cornelius.

10:4 and when he look on him, he wa afraid, and said, what is it,
lord?  and he said unto him, thi prayer and thine alm are come up
for a memori befor god.

10:5 and now send men to joppa, and call for one simon, whose surname
i peter: 10:6 He lodgeth with one simon a tanner, whose hous is by
th sea side: he shall tell thee what thou oughtest to do.

10:7 and when the angel which spake unto corneliu wa departed, he
cal two of hi household servants, and a devout soldier of them
that wait on him continually; 10:8 and when he had declar all
thes thing unto them, he sent them to joppa.

10:9 On the morrow, as they went on their journey, and drew nigh unto
th city, peter went up upon the housetop to pray about the sixth
hour: 10:10 and he becam veri hungry, and would have eaten: but while
they made ready, he fell into a trance, 10:11 and saw heaven opened,
and a certain vessel descend upon him, as it had been a great sheet
knit at the four corners, and let down to the earth: 10:12 wherein
wer all manner of fourfoot beast of the earth, and wild beasts,
and creep things, and fowl of the air.

10:13 and there came a voic to him, rise, peter; kill, and eat.

10:14 but peter said, not so, lord; for I have never eaten ani thing
that is common or unclean.

10:15 and the voic spake unto him again the second time, what god
hath cleansed, that call not thou common.

10:16 thi wa done thrice: and the vessel wa receiv up again into
heaven.

10:17 now while peter doubt in himself what thi vision which he had
seen should mean, behold, the men which were sent from corneliu had
mad enquiri for simon' house, and stood befor the gate, 10:18 and
called, and ask whether simon, which wa surnam peter, were lodged
there.

10:19 while peter thought on the vision, the spirit said unto him,
behold, three men seek thee.

10:20 aris therefore, and get thee down, and go with them, doubting
nothing: for I have sent them.

10:21 then peter went down to the men which were sent unto him from
cornelius; and said, behold, I am he whom ye seek: what is the cause
wherefor ye are come?  10:22 and they said, corneliu the centurion,
a just man, and one that feareth god, and of good report among all the
nat of the jews, wa warn from god by an holi angel to send for
the into hi house, and to hear word of thee.

10:23 then call he them in, and lodg them. and on the morrow peter
w away with them, and certain brethren from joppa accompani him.

10:24 and the morrow after they enter into caesarea. and cornelius
wait for them, and he had call togeth hi kinsmen and near
friends.

10:25 and as peter wa come in, corneliu met him, and fell down at
hi feet, and worship him.

10:26 but peter took him up, saying, stand up; I myself also am a man.

10:27 and as he talk with him, he went in, and found mani that were
com together.

10:28 and he said unto them, Ye know how that it is an unlaw thing
for a man that is a jew to keep company, or come unto one of another
nation; but god hath shew me that I should not call ani man common
or unclean.

10:29 therefor came I unto you without gainsaying, as soon as I was
sent for: I ask therefor for what intent ye have sent for me?  10:30
and corneliu said, four day ago I wa fast until thi hour; and
at the ninth hour I pray in my house, and, behold, a man stood
befor me in bright clothing, 10:31 and said, cornelius, thi prayer is
heard, and thine alm are had in remembr in the sight of god.

10:32 send therefor to joppa, and call hither simon, whose surnam is
peter; he is lodg in the hous of one simon a tanner by the sea
side: who, when he cometh, shall speak unto thee.

10:33 immedi therefor I sent to thee; and thou hast well done
that thou art come. now therefor are we all here present befor god,
to hear all thing that are command thee of god.

10:34 then peter open hi mouth, and said, Of a truth I perceive
that god is no respect of persons: 10:35 but in everi nation he that
feareth him, and worketh righteousness, is accept with him.

10:36 the word which god sent unto the children of israel, preaching
peac by jesu christ: (he is lord of all:) 10:37 that word, I say, ye
know, which wa publish throughout all judaea, and began from
galilee, after the baptism which john preached; 10:38 how god anointed
jesu of nazareth with the holi ghost and with power: who went about
do good, and heal all that were oppress of the devil; for god
wa with him.

10:39 and we are wit of all thing which he did both in the land
of the jews, and in jerusalem; whom they slew and hang on a tree:
10:40 him god rais up the third day, and shew him openly; 10:41
not to all the people, but unto wit chosen befor god, even to
us, who did eat and drink with him after he rose from the dead.

10:42 and he command us to preach unto the people, and to testify
that it is he which wa ordain of god to be the judg of quick and
dead.

10:43 To him give all the prophet witness, that through hi name
whosoev believeth in him shall receiv remiss of sins.

10:44 while peter yet spake these words, the holi ghost fell on all
them which heard the word.

10:45 and they of the circumcis which believ were astonished, as
mani as came with peter, becaus that on the gentil also wa poured
out the gift of the holi ghost.

10:46 for they heard them speak with tongues, and magnifi god. then
answ peter, 10:47 can ani man forbid water, that these should not
b baptized, which have receiv the holi ghost as well as we?  10:48
and he command them to be baptiz in the name of the lord. then
pray they him to tarri certain days.

11:1 and the apostl and brethren that were in judaea heard that the
gentil had also receiv the word of god.

11:2 and when peter wa come up to jerusalem, they that were of the
circumcis contend with him, 11:3 saying, thou wentest in to men
uncircumcised, and didst eat with them.

11:4 but peter rehears the matter from the beginning, and expounded
it by order unto them, saying, 11:5 I wa in the citi of joppa
praying: and in a tranc I saw a vision, A certain vessel descend, as
it had been a great sheet, let down from heaven by four corners; and
it came even to me: 11:6 upon the which when I had fasten mine eyes,
i considered, and saw fourfoot beast of the earth, and wild beasts,
and creep things, and fowl of the air.

11:7 and I heard a voic say unto me, arise, peter; slay and eat.

11:8 but I said, not so, lord: for noth common or unclean hath at
ani time enter into my mouth.

11:9 but the voic answer me again from heaven, what god hath
cleansed, that call not thou common.

11:10 and thi wa done three times: and all were drawn up again into
heaven.

11:11 and, behold, immedi there were three men alreadi come unto
th hous where I was, sent from caesarea unto me.

11:12 and the spirit bade me go with them, noth doubting. moreover
thes six brethren accompani me, and we enter into the man's
house: 11:13 and he shew us how he had seen an angel in hi house,
which stood and said unto him, send men to joppa, and call for simon,
whos surnam is peter; 11:14 who shall tell thee words, wherebi thou
and all thi hous shall be saved.

11:15 and as I began to speak, the holi ghost fell on them, as on us
at the beginning.

11:16 then rememb I the word of the lord, how that he said, john
inde baptiz with water; but ye shall be baptiz with the holy
ghost.

11:17 forasmuch then as god gave them the like gift as he did unto us,
who believ on the lord jesu christ; what wa I, that I could
withstand god?  11:18 when they heard these things, they held their
peace, and glorifi god, saying, then hath god also to the gentiles
gr repent unto life.

11:19 now they which were scatter abroad upon the persecut that
aros about stephen travel as far as phenice, and cyprus, and
antioch, preach the word to none but unto the jew only.

11:20 and some of them were men of cypru and cyrene, which, when they
wer come to antioch, spake unto the grecians, preach the lord
jesus.

11:21 and the hand of the lord wa with them: and a great number
believed, and turn unto the lord.

11:22 then tide of these thing came unto the ear of the church
which wa in jerusalem: and they sent forth barnabas, that he should
go as far as antioch.

11:23 who, when he came, and had seen the grace of god, wa glad, and
exhort them all, that with purpos of heart they would cleav unto
th lord.

11:24 for he wa a good man, and full of the holi ghost and of faith:
and much peopl wa ad unto the lord.

11:25 then depart barnaba to tarsus, for to seek saul: 11:26 and
when he had found him, he brought him unto antioch. and it came to
pass, that a whole year they assembl themselv with the church, and
taught much people. and the discipl were call christian first in
antioch.

11:27 and in these day came prophet from jerusalem unto antioch.

11:28 and there stood up one of them name agabus, and signifi by
th spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world:
which came to pass in the day of claudiu caesar.

11:29 then the disciples, everi man accord to hi ability,
determin to send relief unto the brethren which dwelt in judaea:
11:30 which also they did, and sent it to the elder by the hand of
barnaba and saul.

12:1 now about that time herod the king stretch forth hi hand to
vex certain of the church.

12:2 and he kill jame the brother of john with the sword.

12:3 and becaus he saw it pleas the jews, he proceed further to
tak peter also. (then were the day of unleaven bread.)  12:4 and
when he had apprehend him, he put him in prison, and deliv him
to four quaternion of soldier to keep him; intend after easter to
br him forth to the people.

12:5 peter therefor wa kept in prison: but prayer wa made without
ceas of the church unto god for him.

12:6 and when herod would have brought him forth, the same night peter
wa sleep between two soldiers, bound with two chains: and the
keep befor the door kept the prison.

12:7 and, behold, the angel of the lord came upon him, and a light
shin in the prison: and he smote peter on the side, and rais him
up, saying, aris up quickly. and hi chain fell off from hi hands.

12:8 and the angel said unto him, gird thyself, and bind on thy
sandals.

and so he did. and he saith unto him, cast thi garment about thee, and
follow me.

12:9 and he went out, and follow him; and wist not that it wa true
which wa done by the angel; but thought he saw a vision.

12:10 when they were past the first and the second ward, they came
unto the iron gate that leadeth unto the city; which open to them of
hi own accord: and they went out, and pass on through one street;
and forthwith the angel depart from him.

12:11 and when peter wa come to himself, he said, now I know of a
surety, that the lord hath sent hi angel, and hath deliv me out
of the hand of herod, and from all the expect of the peopl of
th jews.

12:12 and when he had consid the thing, he came to the hous of
mari the mother of john, whose surnam wa mark; where mani were
gath togeth praying.

12:13 and as peter knock at the door of the gate, a damsel came to
hearken, name rhoda.

12:14 and when she knew peter' voice, she open not the gate for
gladness, but ran in, and told how peter stood befor the gate.

12:15 and they said unto her, thou art mad. but she constantly
affirm that it wa even so. then said they, It is hi angel.

12:16 but peter continu knocking: and when they had open the door,
and saw him, they were astonished.

12:17 but he, beckon unto them with the hand to hold their peace,
declar unto them how the lord had brought him out of the prison. and
h said, Go shew these thing unto james, and to the brethren. and he
departed, and went into anoth place.

12:18 now as soon as it wa day, there wa no small stir among the
soldiers, what wa becom of peter.

12:19 and when herod had sought for him, and found him not, he
examin the keepers, and command that they should be put to death.
and he went down from judaea to caesarea, and there abode.

12:20 and herod wa highli displeas with them of tyre and sidon: but
they came with one accord to him, and, have made blastu the king's
chamberlain their friend, desir peace; becaus their countri was
nourish by the king' country.

12:21 and upon a set day herod, array in royal apparel, sat upon his
throne, and made an orat unto them.

12:22 and the peopl gave a shout, saying, It is the voic of a god,
and not of a man.

12:23 and immedi the angel of the lord smote him, becaus he gave
not god the glory: and he wa eaten of worms, and gave up the ghost.

12:24 but the word of god grew and multiplied.

12:25 and barnaba and saul return from jerusalem, when they had
fulfil their ministry, and took with them john, whose surnam was
mark.

13:1 now there were in the church that wa at antioch certain prophets
and teachers; as barnabas, and simeon that wa call niger, and
luciu of cyrene, and manaen, which had been brought up with herod the
tetrarch, and saul.

13:2 As they minist to the lord, and fasted, the holi ghost said,
separ me barnaba and saul for the work whereunto I have called
them.

13:3 and when they had fast and prayed, and laid their hand on
them, they sent them away.

13:4 So they, be sent forth by the holi ghost, depart unto
seleucia; and from thenc they sail to cyprus.

13:5 and when they were at salamis, they preach the word of god in
th synagogu of the jews: and they had also john to their minister.

13:6 and when they had gone through the isl unto paphos, they found a
certain sorcerer, a fals prophet, a jew, whose name wa barjesus:
13:7 which wa with the deputi of the country, sergiu paulus, a
prud man; who call for barnaba and saul, and desir to hear the
word of god.

13:8 but elyma the sorcer (for so is hi name by interpretation)
withstood them, seek to turn away the deputi from the faith.

13:9 then saul, (who also is call paul,) fill with the holi ghost,
set hi eye on him.

13:10 and said, O full of all subtilti and all mischief, thou child of
th devil, thou enemi of all righteousness, wilt thou not ceas to
pervert the right way of the lord?  13:11 and now, behold, the hand
of the lord is upon thee, and thou shalt be blind, not see the sun
for a season. and immedi there fell on him a mist and a darkness;
and he went about seek some to lead him by the hand.

13:12 then the deputy, when he saw what wa done, believed, being
astonish at the doctrin of the lord.

13:13 now when paul and hi compani loos from paphos, they came to
perga in pamphylia: and john depart from them return to
jerusalem.

13:14 but when they depart from perga, they came to antioch in
pisidia, and went into the synagogu on the sabbath day, and sat down.

13:15 and after the read of the law and the prophet the ruler of
th synagogu sent unto them, saying, Ye men and brethren, if ye have
ani word of exhort for the people, say on.

13:16 then paul stood up, and beckon with hi hand said, men of
israel, and ye that fear god, give audience.

13:17 the god of thi peopl of israel chose our fathers, and exalted
th peopl when they dwelt as stranger in the land of egypt, and with
an high arm brought he them out of it.

13:18 and about the time of forti year suffer he their manner in
th wilderness.

13:19 and when he had destroy seven nation in the land of chanaan,
h divid their land to them by lot.

13:20 and after that he gave unto them judg about the space of four
hundr and fifti years, until samuel the prophet.

13:21 and afterward they desir a king: and god gave unto them saul
th son of cis, a man of the tribe of benjamin, by the space of forty
years.

13:22 and when he had remov him, he rais up unto them david to be
their king; to whom also he gave their testimony, and said, I have
found david the son of jesse, a man after mine own heart, which shall
fulfil all my will.

13:23 Of thi man' seed hath god accord to hi promis rais unto
israel a saviour, jesus: 13:24 when john had first preach befor his
com the baptism of repent to all the peopl of israel.

13:25 and as john fulfil hi course, he said, whom think ye that i
am?  I am not he. but, behold, there cometh one after me, whose shoes
of hi feet I am not worthi to loose.

13:26 men and brethren, children of the stock of abraham, and
whosoev among you feareth god, to you is the word of thi salvation
sent.

13:27 for they that dwell at jerusalem, and their rulers, becaus they
knew him not, nor yet the voic of the prophet which are read every
sabbath day, they have fulfil them in condemn him.

13:28 and though they found no caus of death in him, yet desir they
pil that he should be slain.

13:29 and when they had fulfil all that wa written of him, they
took him down from the tree, and laid him in a sepulchre.

13:30 but god rais him from the dead: 13:31 and he wa seen many
day of them which came up with him from galile to jerusalem, who are
hi wit unto the people.

13:32 and we declar unto you glad tidings, how that the promis which
wa made unto the fathers, 13:33 god hath fulfil the same unto us
their children, in that he hath rais up jesu again; as it is also
written in the second psalm, thou art my son, thi day have I begotten
thee.

13:34 and as concern that he rais him up from the dead, now no
mor to return to corruption, he said on thi wise, I will give you
th sure merci of david.

13:35 wherefor he saith also in anoth psalm, thou shalt not suffer
thin holi one to see corruption.

13:36 for david, after he had serv hi own gener by the will of
god, fell on sleep, and wa laid unto hi fathers, and saw corruption:
13:37 but he, whom god rais again, saw no corruption.

13:38 Be it known unto you therefore, men and brethren, that through
thi man is preach unto you the forgiv of sins: 13:39 and by
him all that believ are justifi from all things, from which ye
could not be justifi by the law of moses.

13:40 bewar therefore, lest that come upon you, which is spoken of in
th prophets; 13:41 behold, ye despisers, and wonder, and perish: for
i work a work in your days, a work which ye shall in no wise believe,
though a man declar it unto you.

13:42 and when the jew were gone out of the synagogue, the gentiles
besought that these word might be preach to them the next sabbath.

13:43 now when the congreg wa broken up, mani of the jew and
religi proselyt follow paul and barnabas: who, speak to
them, persuad them to continu in the grace of god.

13:44 and the next sabbath day came almost the whole citi togeth to
hear the word of god.

13:45 but when the jew saw the multitudes, they were fill with
envy, and spake against those thing which were spoken by paul,
contradict and blaspheming.

13:46 then paul and barnaba wax bold, and said, It wa necessary
that the word of god should first have been spoken to you: but seeing
y put it from you, and judg yourselv unworthi of everlast life,
lo, we turn to the gentiles.

13:47 for so hath the lord command us, saying, I have set thee to be
a light of the gentiles, that thou shouldest be for salvat unto the
end of the earth.

13:48 and when the gentil heard this, they were glad, and glorified
th word of the lord: and as mani as were ordain to etern life
believed.

13:49 and the word of the lord wa publish throughout all the
region.

13:50 but the jew stir up the devout and honour women, and the
chief men of the city, and rais persecut against paul and
barnabas, and expel them out of their coasts.

13:51 but they shook off the dust of their feet against them, and came
unto iconium.

13:52 and the discipl were fill with joy, and with the holi ghost.

14:1 and it came to pass in iconium, that they went both togeth into
th synagogu of the jews, and so spake, that a great multitud both
of the jew and also of the greek believed.

14:2 but the unbeliev jew stir up the gentiles, and made their
mind evil affect against the brethren.

14:3 long time therefor abod they speak boldli in the lord, which
gav testimoni unto the word of hi grace, and grant sign and
wond to be done by their hands.

14:4 but the multitud of the citi wa divided: and part held with the
jews, and part with the apostles.

14:5 and when there wa an assault made both of the gentiles, and also
of the jew with their rulers, to use them despitefully, and to stone
them, 14:6 they were ware of it, and fled unto lystra and derbe,
c of lycaonia, and unto the region that lieth round about: 14:7
and there they preach the gospel.

14:8 and there sat a certain man at lystra, impot in hi feet,
b a crippl from hi mother' womb, who never had walked: 14:9 the
sam heard paul speak: who stedfastli behold him, and perceiving
that he had faith to be healed, 14:10 said with a loud voice, stand
upright on thi feet. and he leap and walked.

14:11 and when the peopl saw what paul had done, they lift up their
voices, say in the speech of lycaonia, the god are come down to us
in the like of men.

14:12 and they call barnabas, jupiter; and paul, mercurius, because
h wa the chief speaker.

14:13 then the priest of jupiter, which wa befor their city, brought
oxen and garland unto the gates, and would have done sacrific with
th people.

14:14 which when the apostles, barnaba and paul, heard of, they rent
their clothes, and ran in among the people, cri out, 14:15 and
saying, sirs, whi do ye these things? We also are men of like passions
with you, and preach unto you that ye should turn from these vanities
unto the live god, which made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and
al thing that are therein: 14:16 who in time past suffer all
nat to walk in their own ways.

14:17 nevertheless he left not himself without witness, in that he did
good, and gave us rain from heaven, and fruit seasons, fill our
heart with food and gladness.

14:18 and with these say scarc restrain they the people, that
they had not done sacrific unto them.

14:19 and there came thither certain jew from antioch and iconium,
who persuad the people, and have stone paul, drew him out of the
city, suppos he had been dead.

14:20 howbeit, as the discipl stood round about him, he rose up, and
cam into the city: and the next day he depart with barnaba to
derbe.

14:21 and when they had preach the gospel to that city, and had
taught many, they return again to lystra, and to iconium, and
antioch, 14:22 confirm the soul of the disciples, and exhorting
them to continu in the faith, and that we must through much
tribul enter into the kingdom of god.

14:23 and when they had ordain them elder in everi church, and had
pray with fasting, they commend them to the lord, on whom they
believed.

14:24 and after they had pass throughout pisidia, they came to
pamphylia.

14:25 and when they had preach the word in perga, they went down
into attalia: 14:26 and thenc sail to antioch, from whenc they had
been recommend to the grace of god for the work which they
fulfilled.

14:27 and when they were come, and had gather the church together,
they rehears all that god had done with them, and how he had opened
th door of faith unto the gentiles.

14:28 and there they abod long time with the disciples.

15:1 and certain men which came down from judaea taught the brethren,
and said, except ye be circumcis after the manner of moses, ye
cannot be saved.

15:2 when therefor paul and barnaba had no small dissens and
disput with them, they determin that paul and barnabas, and
certain other of them, should go up to jerusalem unto the apostl and
eld about thi question.

15:3 and be brought on their way by the church, they pass through
phenic and samaria, declar the convers of the gentiles: and
they caus great joy unto all the brethren.

15:4 and when they were come to jerusalem, they were receiv of the
church, and of the apostl and elders, and they declar all things
that god had done with them.

15:5 but there rose up certain of the sect of the pharise which
believed, saying, that it wa need to circumcis them, and to
command them to keep the law of moses.

15:6 and the apostl and elder came togeth for to consid of this
matter.

15:7 and when there had been much disputing, peter rose up, and said
unto them, men and brethren, ye know how that a good while ago god
mad choic among us, that the gentil by my mouth should hear the
word of the gospel, and believe.

15:8 and god, which knoweth the hearts, bare them witness, give them
th holi ghost, even as he did unto us; 15:9 and put no difference
between us and them, purifi their heart by faith.

15:10 now therefor whi tempt ye god, to put a yoke upon the neck of
th disciples, which neither our father nor we were abl to bear?
15:11 but we believ that through the grace of the lord jesu christ
w shall be saved, even as they.

15:12 then all the multitud kept silence, and gave audienc to
barnaba and paul, declar what miracl and wonder god had wrought
among the gentil by them.

15:13 and after they had held their peace, jame answered, saying, men
and brethren, hearken unto me: 15:14 simeon hath declar how god at
th first did visit the gentiles, to take out of them a peopl for his
name.

15:15 and to thi agre the word of the prophets; as it is written,
15:16 after thi I will return, and will build again the tabernacl of
david, which is fallen down; and I will build again the ruin thereof,
and I will set it up: 15:17 that the residu of men might seek after
th lord, and all the gentiles, upon whom my name is called, saith the
lord, who doeth all these things.

15:18 known unto god are all hi work from the begin of the
world.

15:19 wherefor my sentenc is, that we troubl not them, which from
among the gentil are turn to god: 15:20 but that we write unto
them, that they abstain from pollut of idols, and from
fornication, and from thing strangled, and from blood.

15:21 for mose of old time hath in everi citi them that preach him,
b read in the synagogu everi sabbath day.

15:22 then pleas it the apostl and elder with the whole church,
to send chosen men of their own compani to antioch with paul and
barnabas; namely, juda surnam barsaba and silas, chief men among
th brethren: 15:23 and they wrote letter by them after thi manner;
th apostl and elder and brethren send greet unto the brethren
which are of the gentil in antioch and syria and cilicia.

15:24 forasmuch as we have heard, that certain which went out from us
hav troubl you with words, subvert your souls, saying, Ye must
b circumcised, and keep the law: to whom we gave no such commandment:
15:25 It seem good unto us, be assembl with one accord, to send
chosen men unto you with our belov barnaba and paul, 15:26 men that
hav hazard their live for the name of our lord jesu christ.

15:27 We have sent therefor juda and silas, who shall also tell you
th same thing by mouth.

15:28 for it seem good to the holi ghost, and to us, to lay upon you
no greater burden than these necessari things; 15:29 that ye abstain
from meat offer to idols, and from blood, and from things
strangled, and from fornication: from which if ye keep yourselves, ye
shal do well. fare ye well.

15:30 So when they were dismissed, they came to antioch: and when they
had gather the multitud together, they deliv the epistle: 15:31
which when they had read, they rejoic for the consolation.

15:32 and juda and silas, be prophet also themselves, exhorted
th brethren with mani words, and confirm them.

15:33 and after they had tarri there a space, they were let go in
peac from the brethren unto the apostles.

15:34 notwithstand it pleas sila to abid there still.

15:35 paul also and barnaba continu in antioch, teach and
preach the word of the lord, with mani other also.

15:36 and some day after paul said unto barnabas, let us go again and
visit our brethren in everi citi where we have preach the word of
th lord, and see how they do.

15:37 and barnaba determin to take with them john, whose surname
wa mark.

15:38 but paul thought not good to take him with them, who departed
from them from pamphylia, and went not with them to the work.

15:39 and the content wa so sharp between them, that they departed
asund one from the other: and so barnaba took mark, and sail unto
cyprus; 15:40 and paul chose silas, and departed, be recommend by
th brethren unto the grace of god.

15:41 and he went through syria and cilicia, confirm the churches.

16:1 then came he to derb and lystra: and, behold, a certain disciple
wa there, name timotheus, the son of a certain woman, which wa a
jewess, and believed; but hi father wa a greek: 16:2 which wa well
report of by the brethren that were at lystra and iconium.

16:3 him would paul have to go forth with him; and took and
circumcis him becaus of the jew which were in those quarters: for
they knew all that hi father wa a greek.

16:4 and as they went through the cities, they deliv them the
decre for to keep, that were ordain of the apostl and elders
which were at jerusalem.

16:5 and so were the church establish in the faith, and increased
in number daily.

16:6 now when they had gone throughout phrygia and the region of
galatia, and were forbidden of the holi ghost to preach the word in
asia, 16:7 after they were come to mysia, they assay to go into
bithynia: but the spirit suffer them not.

16:8 and they pass by mysia came down to troas.

16:9 and a vision appear to paul in the night; there stood a man of
macedonia, and pray him, saying, come over into macedonia, and help
us.

16:10 and after he had seen the vision, immedi we endeavour to
go into macedonia, assuredli gather that the lord had call us for
to preach the gospel unto them.

16:11 therefor loos from troas, we came with a straight cours to
samothracia, and the next day to neapolis; 16:12 and from thenc to
philippi, which is the chief citi of that part of macedonia, and a
colony: and we were in that citi abid certain days.

16:13 and on the sabbath we went out of the citi by a river side,
wher prayer wa wont to be made; and we sat down, and spake unto the
women which resort thither.

16:14 and a certain woman name lydia, a seller of purple, of the city
of thyatira, which worship god, heard us: whose heart the lord
opened, that she attend unto the thing which were spoken of paul.

16:15 and when she wa baptized, and her household, she besought us,
saying, If ye have judg me to be faith to the lord, come into my
house, and abid there. and she constrain us.

16:16 and it came to pass, as we went to prayer, a certain damsel
possess with a spirit of divin met us, which brought her
mast much gain by soothsaying: 16:17 the same follow paul and us,
and cried, saying, these men are the servant of the most high god,
which shew unto us the way of salvation.

16:18 and thi did she mani days. but paul, be grieved, turn and
said to the spirit, I command thee in the name of jesu christ to come
out of her.

and he came out the same hour.

16:19 and when her master saw that the hope of their gain wa gone,
they caught paul and silas, and drew them into the marketplac unto
th rulers, 16:20 and brought them to the magistrates, saying, these
men, be jews, do exceedingli troubl our city, 16:21 and teach
customs, which are not law for us to receive, neither to observe,
b romans.

16:22 and the multitud rose up togeth against them: and the
magistr rent off their clothes, and command to beat them.

16:23 and when they had laid mani stripe upon them, they cast them
into prison, charg the jailor to keep them safely: 16:24 who,
hav receiv such a charge, thrust them into the inner prison, and
mad their feet fast in the stocks.

16:25 and at midnight paul and sila prayed, and sang prais unto
god: and the prison heard them.

16:26 and suddenli there wa a great earthquake, so that the
found of the prison were shaken: and immedi all the doors
wer opened, and everi one' band were loosed.

16:27 and the keeper of the prison awak out of hi sleep, and
se the prison door open, he drew out hi sword, and would have
kil himself, suppos that the prison had been fled.

16:28 but paul cri with a loud voice, saying, Do thyself no harm:
for we are all here.

16:29 then he call for a light, and sprang in, and came trembling,
and fell down befor paul and silas, 16:30 and brought them out, and
said, sirs, what must I do to be saved?  16:31 and they said, believe
on the lord jesu christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thi house.

16:32 and they spake unto him the word of the lord, and to all that
wer in hi house.

16:33 and he took them the same hour of the night, and wash their
stripes; and wa baptized, he and all his, straightway.

16:34 and when he had brought them into hi house, he set meat before
them, and rejoiced, believ in god with all hi house.

16:35 and when it wa day, the magistr sent the serjeants, saying,
let those men go.

16:36 and the keeper of the prison told thi say to paul, the
magistr have sent to let you go: now therefor depart, and go in
peace.

16:37 but paul said unto them, they have beaten us openli uncondemned,
b romans, and have cast us into prison; and now do they thrust us
out privily? nay verily; but let them come themselv and fetch us
out.

16:38 and the serjeant told these word unto the magistrates: and
they feared, when they heard that they were romans.

16:39 and they came and besought them, and brought them out, and
desir them to depart out of the city.

16:40 and they went out of the prison, and enter into the hous of
lydia: and when they had seen the brethren, they comfort them, and
departed.

17:1 now when they had pass through amphipoli and apollonia, they
cam to thessalonica, where wa a synagogu of the jews: 17:2 and
paul, as hi manner was, went in unto them, and three sabbath days
reason with them out of the scriptures, 17:3 open and alleging,
that christ must need have suffered, and risen again from the dead;
and that thi jesus, whom I preach unto you, is christ.

17:4 and some of them believed, and consort with paul and silas; and
of the devout greek a great multitude, and of the chief women not a
few.

17:5 but the jew which believ not, move with envy, took unto them
certain lewd fellow of the baser sort, and gather a company, and
set all the citi on an uproar, and assault the hous of jason, and
sought to bring them out to the people.

17:6 and when they found them not, they drew jason and certain
brethren unto the ruler of the city, crying, these that have turned
th world upsid down are come hither also; 17:7 whom jason hath
received: and these all do contrari to the decre of caesar, saying
that there is anoth king, one jesus.

17:8 and they troubl the peopl and the ruler of the city, when
they heard these things.

17:9 and when they had taken secur of jason, and of the other, they
let them go.

17:10 and the brethren immedi sent away paul and sila by night
unto berea: who come thither went into the synagogu of the jews.

17:11 these were more nobl than those in thessalonica, in that they
receiv the word with all readi of mind, and search the
scriptur daily, whether those thing were so.

17:12 therefor mani of them believed; also of honour women which
wer greeks, and of men, not a few.

17:13 but when the jew of thessalonica had knowledg that the word of
god wa preach of paul at berea, they came thither also, and stirred
up the people.

17:14 and then immedi the brethren sent away paul to go as it
wer to the sea: but sila and timotheu abod there still.

17:15 and they that conduct paul brought him unto athens: and
receiv a command unto sila and timotheu for to come to him
with all speed, they departed.

17:16 now while paul wait for them at athens, hi spirit wa stirred
in him, when he saw the citi wholli given to idolatry.

17:17 therefor disput he in the synagogu with the jews, and with
th devout persons, and in the market daili with them that met with
him.

17:18 then certain philosoph of the epicureans, and of the stoicks,
encount him. and some said, what will thi babbler say? other
some, He seemeth to be a setter forth of strang gods: becaus he
preach unto them jesus, and the resurrection.

17:19 and they took him, and brought him unto areopagus, saying, may
w know what thi new doctrine, whereof thou speakest, is?  17:20 for
thou bringest certain strang thing to our ears: we would know
therefor what these thing mean.

17:21 (for all the athenian and stranger which were there spent
their time in noth else, but either to tell, or to hear some new
thing.)  17:22 then paul stood in the midst of mars' hill, and said,
y men of athens, I perceiv that in all thing ye are too
superstitious.

17:23 for as I pass by, and beheld your devotions, I found an altar
with thi inscription, TO the unknown god. whom therefor ye
ignorantli worship, him declar I unto you.

17:24 god that made the world and all thing therein, see that he
i lord of heaven and earth, dwelleth not in templ made with hands;
17:25 neither is worship with men' hands, as though he need any
thing, see he giveth to all life, and breath, and all things; 17:26
and hath made of one blood all nation of men for to dwell on all the
fac of the earth, and hath determin the time befor appointed, and
th bound of their habitation; 17:27 that they should seek the lord,
if hapli they might feel after him, and find him, though he be not far
from everi one of us: 17:28 for in him we live, and move, and have our
being; as certain also of your own poet have said, for we are also
hi offspring.

17:29 forasmuch then as we are the offspr of god, we ought not to
think that the godhead is like unto gold, or silver, or stone, graven
bi art and man' device.

17:30 and the time of thi ignor god wink at; but now
commandeth all men everi where to repent: 17:31 becaus he hath
appoint a day, in the which he will judg the world in righteousness
bi that man whom he hath ordained; whereof he hath given assurance
unto all men, in that he hath rais him from the dead.

17:32 and when they heard of the resurrect of the dead, some
mocked: and other said, We will hear thee again of thi matter.

17:33 So paul depart from among them.

17:34 howbeit certain men clave unto him, and believed: among the
which wa dionysiu the areopagite, and a woman name damaris, and
oth with them.

18:1 after these thing paul depart from athens, and came to
corinth; 18:2 and found a certain jew name aquila, born in pontus,
l come from italy, with hi wife priscilla; (becaus that
claudiu had command all jew to depart from rome:) and came unto
them.

18:3 and becaus he wa of the same craft, he abod with them, and
wrought: for by their occup they were tentmakers.

18:4 and he reason in the synagogu everi sabbath, and persuad the
jew and the greeks.

18:5 and when sila and timotheu were come from macedonia, paul was
press in the spirit, and testifi to the jew that jesu was
christ.

18:6 and when they oppos themselves, and blasphemed, he shook his
raiment, and said unto them, your blood be upon your own heads; I am
clean; from henceforth I will go unto the gentiles.

18:7 and he depart thence, and enter into a certain man' house,
nam justus, one that worship god, whose hous join hard to the
synagogue.

18:8 and crispus, the chief ruler of the synagogue, believ on the
lord with all hi house; and mani of the corinthian hear believed,
and were baptized.

18:9 then spake the lord to paul in the night by a vision, Be not
afraid, but speak, and hold not thi peace: 18:10 for I am with thee,
and no man shall set on thee to hurt thee: for I have much peopl in
thi city.

18:11 and he continu there a year and six months, teach the word
of god among them.

18:12 and when gallio wa the deputi of achaia, the jew made
insurrect with one accord against paul, and brought him to the
judg seat, 18:13 saying, thi fellow persuadeth men to worship god
contrari to the law.

18:14 and when paul wa now about to open hi mouth, gallio said unto
th jews, If it were a matter of wrong or wick lewdness, O ye jews,
reason would that I should bear with you: 18:15 but if it be a
quest of word and names, and of your law, look ye to it; for i
wil be no judg of such matters.

18:16 and he drave them from the judgment seat.

18:17 then all the greek took sosthenes, the chief ruler of the
synagogue, and beat him befor the judgment seat. and gallio care for
non of those things.

18:18 and paul after thi tarri there yet a good while, and then
took hi leav of the brethren, and sail thenc into syria, and with
him priscilla and aquila; have shorn hi head in cenchrea: for he
had a vow.

18:19 and he came to ephesus, and left them there: but he himself
ent into the synagogue, and reason with the jews.

18:20 when they desir him to tarri longer time with them, he
cons not; 18:21 but bade them farewell, saying, I must by all
mean keep thi feast that cometh in jerusalem: but I will return
again unto you, if god will. and he sail from ephesus.

18:22 and when he had land at caesarea, and gone up, and salut the
church, he went down to antioch.

18:23 and after he had spent some time there, he departed, and went
ov all the countri of galatia and phrygia in order, strengthening
al the disciples.

18:24 and a certain jew name apollos, born at alexandria, an eloquent
man, and mighti in the scriptures, came to ephesus.

18:25 thi man wa instruct in the way of the lord; and being
ferv in the spirit, he spake and taught dilig the thing of
th lord, know onli the baptism of john.

18:26 and he began to speak boldli in the synagogue: whom when aquila
and priscilla had heard, they took him unto them, and expound unto
him the way of god more perfectly.

18:27 and when he wa dispos to pass into achaia, the brethren
wrote, exhort the discipl to receiv him: who, when he wa come,
help them much which had believ through grace: 18:28 for he
mightili convinc the jews, and that publickly, shew by the
scriptur that jesu wa christ.

19:1 and it came to pass, that, while apollo wa at corinth, paul
hav pass through the upper coast came to ephesus: and finding
certain disciples, 19:2 He said unto them, have ye receiv the holy
ghost sinc ye believed?  and they said unto him, We have not so much
a heard whether there be ani holi ghost.

19:3 and he said unto them, unto what then were ye baptized? and they
said, unto john' baptism.

19:4 then said paul, john verili baptiz with the baptism of
repentance, say unto the people, that they should believ on him
which should come after him, that is, on christ jesus.

19:5 when they heard this, they were baptiz in the name of the lord
jesus.

19:6 and when paul had laid hi hand upon them, the holi ghost came
on them; and they spake with tongues, and prophesied.

19:7 and all the men were about twelve.

19:8 and he went into the synagogue, and spake boldli for the space of
thre months, disput and persuad the thing concern the
kingdom of god.
