19:9 but when diver were hardened, and believ not, but spake evil
of that way befor the multitude, he depart from them, and separated
th disciples, disput daili in the school of one tyrannus.

19:10 and thi continu by the space of two years; so that all they
which dwelt in asia heard the word of the lord jesus, both jew and
greeks.

19:11 and god wrought special miracl by the hand of paul: 19:12 so
that from hi bodi were brought unto the sick handkerchief or aprons,
and the diseas depart from them, and the evil spirit went out of
them.

19:13 then certain of the vagabond jews, exorcists, took upon them to
cal over them which had evil spirit the name of the lord jesus,
saying, We adjur you by jesu whom paul preacheth.

19:14 and there were seven son of one sceva, a jew, and chief of the
priests, which did so.

19:15 and the evil spirit answer and said, jesu I know, and paul i
know; but who are ye?  19:16 and the man in whom the evil spirit was
leap on them, and overcam them, and prevail against them, so that
they fled out of that hous nake and wounded.

19:17 and thi wa known to all the jew and greek also dwell at
ephesus; and fear fell on them all, and the name of the lord jesu was
magnified.

19:18 and mani that believ came, and confessed, and shew their
deeds.

19:19 mani of them also which use curiou art brought their books
together, and burn them befor all men: and they count the price
of them, and found it fifti thousand piec of silver.

19:20 So mightili grew the word of god and prevailed.

19:21 after these thing were ended, paul purpos in the spirit, when
h had pass through macedonia and achaia, to go to jerusalem,
saying, after I have been there, I must also see rome.

19:22 So he sent into macedonia two of them that minist unto him,
timotheu and erastus; but he himself stay in asia for a season.

19:23 and the same time there aros no small stir about that way.

19:24 for a certain man name demetrius, a silversmith, which made
silv shrine for diana, brought no small gain unto the craftsmen;
19:25 whom he call togeth with the workmen of like occupation, and
said, sirs, ye know that by thi craft we have our wealth.

19:26 moreov ye see and hear, that not alon at ephesus, but almost
throughout all asia, thi paul hath persuad and turn away much
people, say that they be no gods, which are made with hands: 19:27
so that not onli thi our craft is in danger to be set at nought; but
also that the templ of the great goddess diana should be despised,
and her magnific should be destroyed, whom all asia and the world
worshippeth.

19:28 and when they heard these sayings, they were full of wrath, and
cri out, saying, great is diana of the ephesians.

19:29 and the whole citi wa fill with confusion: and have caught
gaiu and aristarchus, men of macedonia, paul' companion in travel,
they rush with one accord into the theatre.

19:30 and when paul would have enter in unto the people, the
discipl suffer him not.

19:31 and certain of the chief of asia, which were hi friends, sent
unto him, desir him that he would not adventur himself into the
theatre.

19:32 some therefor cri one thing, and some another: for the
assembl wa confused: and the more part knew not wherefor they were
com together.

19:33 and they drew alexand out of the multitude, the jew putting
him forward. and alexand beckon with the hand, and would have made
hi defenc unto the people.

19:34 but when they knew that he wa a jew, all with one voic about
th space of two hour cri out, great is diana of the ephesians.

19:35 and when the townclerk had appeas the people, he said, Ye men
of ephesus, what man is there that knoweth not how that the citi of
th ephesian is a worshipp of the great goddess diana, and of the
imag which fell down from jupiter?  19:36 see then that these
th cannot be spoken against, ye ought to be quiet, and to do
noth rashly.

19:37 for ye have brought hither these men, which are neither robbers
of churches, nor yet blasphem of your goddess.

19:38 wherefor if demetrius, and the craftsmen which are with him,
hav a matter against ani man, the law is open, and there are
deputies: let them implead one another.

19:39 but if ye enquir ani thing concern other matters, it shall
b determin in a law assembly.

19:40 for we are in danger to be call in question for thi day's
uproar, there be no caus wherebi we may give an account of this
concourse.

19:41 and when he had thu spoken, he dismiss the assembly.

20:1 and after the uproar wa ceased, paul call unto him the
disciples, and embrac them, and depart for to go into macedonia.

20:2 and when he had gone over those parts, and had given them much
exhortation, he came into greece, 20:3 and there abod three months.
and when the jew laid wait for him, as he wa about to sail into
syria, he purpos to return through macedonia.

20:4 and there accompani him into asia sopat of berea; and of the
thessalonians, aristarchu and secundus; and gaiu of derbe, and
timotheus; and of asia, tychicu and trophimus.

20:5 these go befor tarri for us at troas.

20:6 and we sail away from philippi after the day of unleavened
bread, and came unto them to troa in five days; where we abod seven
days.

20:7 and upon the first day of the week, when the discipl came
togeth to break bread, paul preach unto them, readi to depart on
th morrow; and continu hi speech until midnight.

20:8 and there were mani light in the upper chamber, where they were
gath together.

20:9 and there sat in a window a certain young man name eutychus,
b fallen into a deep sleep: and as paul wa long preaching, he
sunk down with sleep, and fell down from the third loft, and wa taken
up dead.

20:10 and paul went down, and fell on him, and embrac him said,
troubl not yourselves; for hi life is in him.

20:11 when he therefor wa come up again, and had broken bread, and
eaten, and talk a long while, even till break of day, so he
departed.

20:12 and they brought the young man alive, and were not a little
comforted.

20:13 and we went befor to ship, and sail unto assos, there
intend to take in paul: for so had he appointed, mind himself to
go afoot.

20:14 and when he met with us at assos, we took him in, and came to
mitylene.

20:15 and we sail thence, and came the next day over against chios;
and the next day we arriv at samos, and tarri at trogyllium; and
th next day we came to miletus.

20:16 for paul had determin to sail by ephesus, becaus he would not
spend the time in asia: for he hasted, if it were possibl for him, to
b at jerusalem the day of pentecost.

20:17 and from miletu he sent to ephesus, and call the elder of
th church.

20:18 and when they were come to him, he said unto them, Ye know, from
th first day that I came into asia, after what manner I have been
with you at all seasons, 20:19 serv the lord with all humil of
mind, and with mani tears, and temptations, which befel me by the
li in wait of the jews: 20:20 and how I kept back noth that was
profit unto you, but have shew you, and have taught you
publickly, and from hous to house, 20:21 testifi both to the jews,
and also to the greeks, repent toward god, and faith toward our
lord jesu christ.

20:22 and now, behold, I go bound in the spirit unto jerusalem, not
know the thing that shall befal me there: 20:23 save that the
holi ghost witnesseth in everi city, say that bond and afflictions
abid me.

20:24 but none of these thing move me, neither count I my life dear
unto myself, so that I might finish my cours with joy, and the
ministry, which I have receiv of the lord jesus, to testifi the
gospel of the grace of god.

20:25 and now, behold, I know that ye all, among whom I have gone
preach the kingdom of god, shall see my face no more.

20:26 wherefor I take you to record thi day, that I am pure from the
blood of all men.

20:27 for I have not shun to declar unto you all the counsel of
god.

20:28 take heed therefor unto yourselves, and to all the flock, over
th which the holi ghost hath made you overseers, to feed the church
of god, which he hath purchas with hi own blood.

20:29 for I know this, that after my depart shall grievou wolves
ent in among you, not spare the flock.

20:30 also of your own selv shall men arise, speak perverse
things, to draw away discipl after them.

20:31 therefor watch, and remember, that by the space of three years
i ceas not to warn everi one night and day with tears.

20:32 and now, brethren, I commend you to god, and to the word of his
grace, which is abl to build you up, and to give you an inheritance
among all them which are sanctified.

20:33 I have covet no man' silver, or gold, or apparel.

20:34 yea, ye yourselv know, that these hand have minist unto
mi necessities, and to them that were with me.

20:35 I have shew you all things, how that so labour ye ought to
support the weak, and to rememb the word of the lord jesus, how he
said, It is more bless to give than to receive.

20:36 and when he had thu spoken, he kneel down, and pray with
them all.

20:37 and they all wept sore, and fell on paul' neck, and kiss him,
20:38 sorrow most of all for the word which he spake, that they
should see hi face no more. and they accompani him unto the ship.

21:1 and it came to pass, that after we were gotten from them, and had
launched, we came with a straight cours unto coos, and the day
follow unto rhodes, and from thenc unto patara: 21:2 and find a
ship sail over unto phenicia, we went aboard, and set forth.

21:3 now when we had discov cyprus, we left it on the left hand,
and sail into syria, and land at tyre: for there the ship wa to
unlad her burden.

21:4 and find disciples, we tarri there seven days: who said to
paul through the spirit, that he should not go up to jerusalem.

21:5 and when we had accomplish those days, we depart and went our
way; and they all brought us on our way, with wive and children, till
w were out of the city: and we kneel down on the shore, and prayed.

21:6 and when we had taken our leav one of another, we took ship; and
they return home again.

21:7 and when we had finish our cours from tyre, we came to
ptolemais, and salut the brethren, and abod with them one day.

21:8 and the next day we that were of paul' compani departed, and
cam unto caesarea: and we enter into the hous of philip the
evangelist, which wa one of the seven; and abod with him.

21:9 and the same man had four daughters, virgins, which did prophesy.

21:10 and as we tarri there mani days, there came down from judaea a
certain prophet, name agabus.

21:11 and when he wa come unto us, he took paul' girdle, and bound
hi own hand and feet, and said, thu saith the holi ghost, So shall
th jew at jerusalem bind the man that owneth thi girdle, and shall
deliv him into the hand of the gentiles.

21:12 and when we heard these things, both we, and they of that place,
besought him not to go up to jerusalem.

21:13 then paul answered, what mean ye to weep and to break mine
heart?  for I am readi not to be bound only, but also to die at
jerusalem for the name of the lord jesus.

21:14 and when he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, the will
of the lord be done.

21:15 and after those day we took up our carriages, and went up to
jerusalem.

21:16 there went with us also certain of the discipl of caesarea,
and brought with them one mnason of cyprus, an old disciple, with whom
w should lodge.

21:17 and when we were come to jerusalem, the brethren receiv us
gladly.

21:18 and the day follow paul went in with us unto james; and all
th elder were present.

21:19 and when he had salut them, he declar particularli what
th god had wrought among the gentil by hi ministry.

21:20 and when they heard it, they glorifi the lord, and said unto
him, thou seest, brother, how mani thousand of jew there are which
believe; and they are all zealou of the law: 21:21 and they are
inform of thee, that thou teachest all the jew which are among the
gentil to forsak moses, say that they ought not to circumcise
their children, neither to walk after the customs.

21:22 what is it therefore? the multitud must need come together:
for they will hear that thou art come.

21:23 Do therefor thi that we say to thee: We have four men which
hav a vow on them; 21:24 them take, and purifi thyself with them, and
b at charg with them, that they may shave their heads: and all may
know that those things, whereof they were inform concern thee,
ar nothing; but that thou thyself also walkest orderly, and keepest
th law.

21:25 As touch the gentil which believe, we have written and
conclud that they observ no such thing, save onli that they keep
themselv from thing offer to idols, and from blood, and from
strangled, and from fornication.

21:26 then paul took the men, and the next day purifi himself with
them enter into the temple, to signifi the accomplish of the
day of purification, until that an offer should be offer for
everi one of them.

21:27 and when the seven day were almost ended, the jew which were
of asia, when they saw him in the temple, stir up all the people,
and laid hand on him, 21:28 cri out, men of israel, help: thi is
th man, that teacheth all men everi where against the people, and the
law, and thi place: and further brought greek also into the temple,
and hath pollut thi holi place.

21:29 (for they had seen befor with him in the citi trophimu an
ephesian, whom they suppos that paul had brought into the temple.)
21:30 and all the citi wa moved, and the peopl ran together: and
they took paul, and drew him out of the temple: and forthwith the
door were shut.

21:31 and as they went about to kill him, tide came unto the chief
captain of the band, that all jerusalem wa in an uproar.

21:32 who immedi took soldier and centurions, and ran down unto
them: and when they saw the chief captain and the soldiers, they left
beat of paul.

21:33 then the chief captain came near, and took him, and commanded
him to be bound with two chains; and demand who he was, and what he
had done.

21:34 and some cri one thing, some another, among the multitude: and
when he could not know the certainti for the tumult, he command him
to be carri into the castle.

21:35 and when he came upon the stairs, so it was, that he wa borne
of the soldier for the violenc of the people.

21:36 for the multitud of the peopl follow after, crying, away
with him.

21:37 and as paul wa to be led into the castle, he said unto the
chief captain, may I speak unto thee? who said, canst thou speak
greek?  21:38 art not thou that egyptian, which befor these days
madest an uproar, and leddest out into the wilder four thousand
men that were murderers?  21:39 but paul said, I am a man which am a
jew of tarsus, a citi in cilicia, a citizen of no mean city: and, i
beseech thee, suffer me to speak unto the people.

21:40 and when he had given him licence, paul stood on the stairs, and
beckon with the hand unto the people. and when there wa made a
great silence, he spake unto them in the hebrew tongue, saying, 22:1
men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defenc which I make now unto
you.

22:2 (and when they heard that he spake in the hebrew tongu to them,
they kept the more silence: and he saith,) 22:3 I am verili a man
which am a jew, born in tarsus, a citi in cilicia, yet brought up in
thi citi at the feet of gamaliel, and taught accord to the perfect
mann of the law of the fathers, and wa zealou toward god, as ye
al are thi day.

22:4 and I persecut thi way unto the death, bind and delivering
into prison both men and women.

22:5 As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate
of the elders: from whom also I receiv letter unto the brethren,
and went to damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto
jerusalem, for to be punished.

22:6 and it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and wa come
nigh unto damascu about noon, suddenli there shone from heaven a
great light round about me.

22:7 and I fell unto the ground, and heard a voic say unto me,
saul, saul, whi persecutest thou me?  22:8 and I answered, who art
thou, lord? and he said unto me, I am jesu of nazareth, whom thou
persecutest.

22:9 and they that were with me saw inde the light, and were afraid;
but they heard not the voic of him that spake to me.

22:10 and I said, what shall I do, lord? and the lord said unto me,
arise, and go into damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all
th which are appoint for thee to do.

22:11 and when I could not see for the glori of that light, be led
bi the hand of them that were with me, I came into damascus.

22:12 and one ananias, a devout man accord to the law, have a
good report of all the jew which dwelt there, 22:13 came unto me, and
stood, and said unto me, brother saul, receiv thi sight. and the same
hour I look up upon him.

22:14 and he said, the god of our father hath chosen thee, that thou
shouldest know hi will, and see that just one, and shouldest hear the
voic of hi mouth.

22:15 for thou shalt be hi wit unto all men of what thou hast
seen and heard.

22:16 and now whi tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away
thi sins, call on the name of the lord.

22:17 and it came to pass, that, when I wa come again to jerusalem,
even while I pray in the temple, I wa in a trance; 22:18 and saw
him say unto me, make haste, and get thee quickli out of jerusalem:
for they will not receiv thi testimoni concern me.

22:19 and I said, lord, they know that I imprison and beat in every
synagogu them that believ on thee: 22:20 and when the blood of thy
martyr stephen wa shed, I also wa stand by, and consent unto
hi death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.

22:21 and he said unto me, depart: for I will send thee far henc unto
th gentiles.

22:22 and they gave him audienc unto thi word, and then lift up
their voices, and said, away with such a fellow from the earth: for it
i not fit that he should live.

22:23 and as they cri out, and cast off their clothes, and threw
dust into the air, 22:24 the chief captain command him to be brought
into the castle, and bade that he should be examin by scourging;
that he might know wherefor they cri so against him.

22:25 and as they bound him with thongs, paul said unto the centurion
that stood by, Is it law for you to scourg a man that is a roman,
and uncondemned?  22:26 when the centurion heard that, he went and
told the chief captain, saying, take heed what thou doest: for this
man is a roman.

22:27 then the chief captain came, and said unto him, tell me, art
thou a roman? He said, yea.

22:28 and the chief captain answered, with a great sum obtain I this
freedom. and paul said, but I wa free born.

22:29 then straightway they depart from him which should have
examin him: and the chief captain also wa afraid, after he knew
that he wa a roman, and becaus he had bound him.

22:30 On the morrow, becaus he would have known the certainty
wherefor he wa accus of the jews, he loos him from hi bands,
and command the chief priest and all their council to appear, and
brought paul down, and set him befor them.

23:1 and paul, earnestli behold the council, said, men and
brethren, I have live in all good conscienc befor god until this
day.

23:2 and the high priest anania command them that stood by him to
smit him on the mouth.

23:3 then said paul unto him, god shall smite thee, thou white wall:
for sittest thou to judg me after the law, and commandest me to be
smitten contrari to the law?  23:4 and they that stood by said,
revilest thou god' high priest?  23:5 then said paul, I wist not,
brethren, that he wa the high priest: for it is written, thou shalt
not speak evil of the ruler of thi people.

23:6 but when paul perceiv that the one part were sadducees, and the
oth pharisees, he cri out in the council, men and brethren, I am a
pharisee, the son of a pharisee: of the hope and resurrect of the
dead I am call in question.

23:7 and when he had so said, there aros a dissens between the
pharise and the sadducees: and the multitud wa divided.

23:8 for the sadduce say that there is no resurrection, neither
angel, nor spirit: but the pharise confess both.

23:9 and there aros a great cry: and the scribe that were of the
pharisees' part arose, and strove, saying, We find no evil in this
man: but if a spirit or an angel hath spoken to him, let us not fight
against god.

23:10 and when there aros a great dissension, the chief captain,
fear lest paul should have been pull in piec of them, commanded
th soldier to go down, and to take him by forc from among them, and
to bring him into the castle.

23:11 and the night follow the lord stood by him, and said, Be of
good cheer, paul: for as thou hast testifi of me in jerusalem, so
must thou bear wit also at rome.

23:12 and when it wa day, certain of the jew band together, and
bound themselv under a curse, say that they would neither eat nor
drink till they had kill paul.

23:13 and they were more than forti which had made thi conspiracy.

23:14 and they came to the chief priest and elders, and said, We have
bound ourselv under a great curse, that we will eat noth until we
hav slain paul.

23:15 now therefor ye with the council signifi to the chief captain
that he bring him down unto you to morrow, as though ye would enquire
someth more perfectli concern him: and we, or ever he come near,
ar readi to kill him.

23:16 and when paul' sister' son heard of their lie in wait, he
went and enter into the castle, and told paul.

23:17 then paul call one of the centurion unto him, and said, bring
thi young man unto the chief captain: for he hath a certain thing to
tel him.

23:18 So he took him, and brought him to the chief captain, and said,
paul the prison call me unto him, and pray me to bring this
young man unto thee, who hath someth to say unto thee.

23:19 then the chief captain took him by the hand, and went with him
asid privately, and ask him, what is that thou hast to tell me?
23:20 and he said, the jew have agre to desir thee that thou
wouldest bring down paul to morrow into the council, as though they
would enquir somewhat of him more perfectly.

23:21 but do not thou yield unto them: for there lie in wait for him
of them more than forti men, which have bound themselv with an oath,
that they will neither eat nor drink till they have kill him: and
now are they ready, look for a promis from thee.

23:22 So the chief captain then let the young man depart, and charged
him, see thou tell no man that thou hast shew these thing to me.

23:23 and he call unto him two centurions, saying, make readi two
hundr soldier to go to caesarea, and horsemen threescor and ten,
and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night; 23:24 and
provid them beasts, that they may set paul on, and bring him safe
unto felix the governor.

23:25 and he wrote a letter after thi manner: 23:26 claudiu lysias
unto the most excel governor felix sendeth greeting.

23:27 thi man wa taken of the jews, and should have been kill of
them: then came I with an army, and rescu him, have understood
that he wa a roman.

23:28 and when I would have known the caus wherefor they accused
him, I brought him forth into their council: 23:29 whom I perceiv to
b accus of question of their law, but to have noth laid to his
charg worthi of death or of bonds.

23:30 and when it wa told me how that the jew laid wait for the man,
i sent straightway to thee, and gave command to hi accus also
to say befor thee what they had against him. farewell.

23:31 then the soldiers, as it wa command them, took paul, and
brought him by night to antipatris.

23:32 On the morrow they left the horsemen to go with him, and
return to the castle: 23:33 who, when they came to caesarea and
deliv the epistl to the governor, present paul also befor him.

23:34 and when the governor had read the letter, he ask of what
provinc he was. and when he understood that he wa of cilicia; 23:35
i will hear thee, said he, when thine accus are also come. and he
command him to be kept in herod' judgment hall.

24:1 and after five day anania the high priest descend with the
elders, and with a certain orat name tertullus, who inform the
governor against paul.

24:2 and when he wa call forth, tertullu began to accus him,
saying, see that by thee we enjoy great quietness, and that very
worthi deed are done unto thi nation by thi providence, 24:3 we
accept it always, and in all places, most nobl felix, with all
thankfulness.

24:4 notwithstanding, that I be not further tediou unto thee, I pray
the that thou wouldest hear us of thi clemenc a few words.

24:5 for we have found thi man a pestil fellow, and a mover of
sedit among all the jew throughout the world, and a ringlead of
th sect of the nazarenes: 24:6 who also hath gone about to profane
th temple: whom we took, and would have judg accord to our law.

24:7 but the chief captain lysia came upon us, and with great
viol took him away out of our hands, 24:8 command hi accusers
to come unto thee: by examin of whom thyself mayest take knowledge
of all these things, whereof we accus him.

24:9 and the jew also assented, say that these thing were so.

24:10 then paul, after that the governor had beckon unto him to
speak, answered, forasmuch as I know that thou hast been of mani years
a judg unto thi nation, I do the more cheer answer for myself:
24:11 becaus that thou mayest understand, that there are yet but
twelv day sinc I went up to jerusalem for to worship.

24:12 and they neither found me in the templ disput with ani man,
neith rais up the people, neither in the synagogues, nor in the
city: 24:13 neither can they prove the thing whereof they now accuse
me.

24:14 but thi I confess unto thee, that after the way which they call
heresy, so worship I the god of my fathers, believ all thing which
ar written in the law and in the prophets: 24:15 and have hope toward
god, which they themselv also allow, that there shall be a
resurrect of the dead, both of the just and unjust.

24:16 and herein do I exercis myself, to have alway a conscience
void to offenc toward god, and toward men.

24:17 now after mani year I came to bring alm to my nation, and
offerings.

24:18 whereupon certain jew from asia found me purifi in the
temple, neither with multitude, nor with tumult.

24:19 who ought to have been here befor thee, and object, if they had
ought against me.

24:20 Or els let these same here say, if they have found ani evil
do in me, while I stood befor the council, 24:21 except it be for
thi one voice, that I cri stand among them, touch the
resurrect of the dead I am call in question by you thi day.

24:22 and when felix heard these things, have more perfect knowledge
of that way, he defer them, and said, when lysia the chief captain
shal come down, I will know the uttermost of your matter.

24:23 and he command a centurion to keep paul, and to let him have
liberty, and that he should forbid none of hi acquaint to
minist or come unto him.

24:24 and after certain days, when felix came with hi wife drusilla,
which wa a jewess, he sent for paul, and heard him concern the
faith in christ.

24:25 and as he reason of righteousness, temperance, and judgment to
come, felix trembled, and answered, Go thi way for thi time; when i
hav a conveni season, I will call for thee.

24:26 He hope also that money should have been given him of paul,
that he might loos him: wherefor he sent for him the oftener, and
commun with him.

24:27 but after two year porciu festu came into felix' room: and
felix, will to shew the jew a pleasure, left paul bound.

25:1 now when festu wa come into the province, after three day he
ascend from caesarea to jerusalem.

25:2 then the high priest and the chief of the jew inform him
against paul, and besought him, 25:3 and desir favour against him,
that he would send for him to jerusalem, lay wait in the way to
kil him.

25:4 but festu answered, that paul should be kept at caesarea, and
that he himself would depart shortli thither.

25:5 let them therefore, said he, which among you are able, go down
with me, and accus thi man, if there be ani wicked in him.

25:6 and when he had tarri among them more than ten days, he went
down unto caesarea; and the next day sit on the judgment seat
command paul to be brought.

25:7 and when he wa come, the jew which came down from jerusalem
stood round about, and laid mani and grievou complaint against paul,
which they could not prove.

25:8 while he answer for himself, neither against the law of the
jews, neither against the temple, nor yet against caesar, have i
offend ani thing at all.

25:9 but festus, will to do the jew a pleasure, answer paul, and
said, wilt thou go up to jerusalem, and there be judg of these
th befor me?  25:10 then said paul, I stand at caesar' judgment
seat, where I ought to be judged: to the jew have I done no wrong, as
thou veri well knowest.

25:11 for if I be an offender, or have commit ani thing worthi of
death, I refus not to die: but if there be none of these things
whereof these accus me, no man may deliv me unto them. I appeal
unto caesar.

25:12 then festus, when he had confer with the council, answered,
hast thou appeal unto caesar? unto caesar shalt thou go.

25:13 and after certain day king agrippa and bernic came unto
caesarea to salut festus.

25:14 and when they had been there mani days, festu declar paul's
caus unto the king, saying, there is a certain man left in bond by
felix: 25:15 about whom, when I wa at jerusalem, the chief priests
and the elder of the jew inform me, desir to have judgment
against him.

25:16 To whom I answered, It is not the manner of the roman to
deliv ani man to die, befor that he which is accus have the
accus face to face, and have licenc to answer for himself
concern the crime laid against him.

25:17 therefore, when they were come hither, without ani delay on the
morrow I sat on the judgment seat, and command the man to be brought
forth.

25:18 against whom when the accus stood up, they brought none
accus of such thing as I supposed: 25:19 but had certain
quest against him of their own superstition, and of one jesus,
which wa dead, whom paul affirm to be alive.

25:20 and becaus I doubt of such manner of questions, I ask him
wheth he would go to jerusalem, and there be judg of these
matters.

25:21 but when paul had appeal to be reserv unto the hear of
augustus, I command him to be kept till I might send him to caesar.

25:22 then agrippa said unto festus, I would also hear the man myself.
to morrow, said he, thou shalt hear him.

25:23 and on the morrow, when agrippa wa come, and bernice, with
great pomp, and wa enter into the place of hearing, with the chief
captains, and princip men of the city, at festus' command paul
wa brought forth.

25:24 and festu said, king agrippa, and all men which are here
pres with us, ye see thi man, about whom all the multitud of the
jew have dealt with me, both at jerusalem, and also here, cri that
h ought not to live ani longer.

25:25 but when I found that he had commit noth worthi of death,
and that he himself hath appeal to augustus, I have determin to
send him.

25:26 Of whom I have no certain thing to write unto my lord. wherefore
i have brought him forth befor you, and special befor thee, O king
agrippa, that, after examin had, I might have somewhat to write.

25:27 for it seemeth to me unreason to send a prisoner, and not
with to signifi the crime laid against him.

26:1 then agrippa said unto paul, thou art permit to speak for
thyself.

then paul stretch forth the hand, and answer for himself: 26:2 i
think myself happy, king agrippa, becaus I shall answer for myself
thi day befor thee touch all the thing whereof I am accus of
th jews: 26:3 especi becaus I know thee to be expert in all
custom and question which are among the jews: wherefor I beseech
the to hear me patiently.

26:4 My manner of life from my youth, which wa at the first among
min own nation at jerusalem, know all the jews; 26:5 which knew me
from the beginning, if they would testify, that after the most
straitest sect of our religion I live a pharisee.

26:6 and now I stand and am judg for the hope of the promis made of
god, unto our fathers: 26:7 unto which promis our twelv tribes,
instantli serv god day and night, hope to come. for which hope's
sake, king agrippa, I am accus of the jews.

26:8 whi should it be thought a thing incred with you, that god
should rais the dead?  26:9 I verili thought with myself, that i
ought to do mani thing contrari to the name of jesu of nazareth.

26:10 which thing I also did in jerusalem: and mani of the saint did
i shut up in prison, have receiv author from the chief priests;
and when they were put to death, I gave my voic against them.

26:11 and I punish them oft in everi synagogue, and compel them
to blaspheme; and be exceedingli mad against them, I persecuted
them even unto strang cities.

26:12 whereupon as I went to damascu with author and commission
from the chief priests, 26:13 At midday, O king, I saw in the way a
light from heaven, abov the bright of the sun, shine round
about me and them which journey with me.

26:14 and when we were all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice
speak unto me, and say in the hebrew tongue, saul, saul, why
persecutest thou me? it is hard for thee to kick against the pricks.

26:15 and I said, who art thou, lord? and he said, I am jesu whom
thou persecutest.

26:16 but rise, and stand upon thi feet: for I have appear unto thee
for thi purpose, to make thee a minist and a wit both of these
th which thou hast seen, and of those thing in the which I will
appear unto thee; 26:17 deliv thee from the people, and from the
gentiles, unto whom now I send thee, 26:18 To open their eyes, and to
turn them from dark to light, and from the power of satan unto
god, that they may receiv forgiv of sins, and inherit among
them which are sanctifi by faith that is in me.

26:19 whereupon, O king agrippa, I wa not disobedi unto the
heavenli vision: 26:20 but shew first unto them of damascus, and at
jerusalem, and throughout all the coast of judaea, and then to the
gentiles, that they should repent and turn to god, and do work meet
for repentance.

26:21 for these caus the jew caught me in the temple, and went
about to kill me.

26:22 have therefor obtain help of god, I continu unto thi day,
wit both to small and great, say none other thing than
thos which the prophet and mose did say should come: 26:23 that
christ should suffer, and that he should be the first that should rise
from the dead, and should shew light unto the people, and to the
gentiles.

26:24 and as he thu spake for himself, festu said with a loud voice,
paul, thou art besid thyself; much learn doth make thee mad.

26:25 but he said, I am not mad, most nobl festus; but speak forth
th word of truth and soberness.

26:26 for the king knoweth of these things, befor whom also I speak
freely: for I am persuad that none of these thing are hidden from
him; for thi thing wa not done in a corner.

26:27 king agrippa, believest thou the prophets? I know that thou
believest.

26:28 then agrippa said unto paul, almost thou persuadest me to be a
christian.

26:29 and paul said, I would to god, that not onli thou, but also all
that hear me thi day, were both almost, and altogeth such as I am,
except these bonds.

26:30 and when he had thu spoken, the king rose up, and the governor,
and bernice, and they that sat with them: 26:31 and when they were
gon aside, they talk between themselves, saying, thi man doeth
noth worthi of death or of bonds.

26:32 then said agrippa unto festus, thi man might have been set at
liberty, if he had not appeal unto caesar.

27:1 and when it wa determin that we should sail into italy, they
deliv paul and certain other prison unto one name julius, a
centurion of augustus' band.

27:2 and enter into a ship of adramyttium, we launched, mean to
sail by the coast of asia; one aristarchus, a macedonian of
thessalonica, be with us.

27:3 and the next day we touch at sidon. and juliu courteously
entr paul, and gave him liberti to go unto hi friend to refresh
himself.

27:4 and when we had launch from thence, we sail under cyprus,
becaus the wind were contrary.

27:5 and when we had sail over the sea of cilicia and pamphylia, we
cam to myra, a citi of lycia.

27:6 and there the centurion found a ship of alexandria sail into
italy; and he put us therein.

27:7 and when we had sail slowli mani days, and scarc were come
ov against cnidus, the wind not suffer us, we sail under crete,
ov against salmone; 27:8 and, hardli pass it, came unto a place
which is call the fair havens; nigh whereunto wa the citi of lasea.

27:9 now when much time wa spent, and when sail wa now dangerous,
becaus the fast wa now alreadi past, paul admonish them, 27:10 and
said unto them, sirs, I perceiv that thi voyag will be with hurt
and much damage, not onli of the lade and ship, but also of our
lives.

27:11 nevertheless the centurion believ the master and the owner of
th ship, more than those thing which were spoken by paul.

27:12 and becaus the haven wa not commodi to winter in, the more
part advis to depart thenc also, if by ani mean they might attain
to phenice, and there to winter; which is an haven of crete, and lieth
toward the south west and north west.

27:13 and when the south wind blew softly, suppos that they had
obtain their purpose, loos thence, they sail close by crete.

27:14 but not long after there aros against it a tempestu wind,
cal euroclydon.

27:15 and when the ship wa caught, and could not bear up into the
wind, we let her drive.

27:16 and run under a certain island which is call clauda, we
had much work to come by the boat: 27:17 which when they had taken up,
they use helps, undergird the ship; and, fear lest they should
fal into the quicksands, strake sail, and so were driven.

27:18 and we be exceedingli toss with a tempest, the next day
they lighten the ship; 27:19 and the third day we cast out with our
own hand the tackl of the ship.

27:20 and when neither sun nor star in mani day appeared, and no
smal tempest lay on us, all hope that we should be save wa then
taken away.

27:21 but after long abstin paul stood forth in the midst of them,
and said, sirs, ye should have hearken unto me, and not have loosed
from crete, and to have gain thi harm and loss.

27:22 and now I exhort you to be of good cheer: for there shall be no
loss of ani man' life among you, but of the ship.

27:23 for there stood by me thi night the angel of god, whose I am,
and whom I serve, 27:24 saying, fear not, paul; thou must be brought
befor caesar: and, lo, god hath given thee all them that sail with
thee.

27:25 wherefore, sirs, be of good cheer: for I believ god, that it
shal be even as it wa told me.

27:26 howbeit we must be cast upon a certain island.

27:27 but when the fourteenth night wa come, as we were driven up and
down in adria, about midnight the shipmen deem that they drew near
to some country; 27:28 and sounded, and found it twenti fathoms: and
when they had gone a littl further, they sound again, and found it
fifteen fathoms.

27:29 then fear lest we should have fallen upon rocks, they cast
four anchor out of the stern, and wish for the day.

27:30 and as the shipmen were about to flee out of the ship, when they
had let down the boat into the sea, under colour as though they would
hav cast anchor out of the foreship, 27:31 paul said to the
centurion and to the soldiers, except these abid in the ship, ye
cannot be saved.

27:32 then the soldier cut off the rope of the boat, and let her
fal off.

27:33 and while the day wa come on, paul besought them all to take
meat, saying, thi day is the fourteenth day that ye have tarri and
continu fasting, have taken nothing.

27:34 wherefor I pray you to take some meat: for thi is for your
health: for there shall not an hair fall from the head of ani of you.

27:35 and when he had thu spoken, he took bread, and gave thank to
god in presenc of them all: and when he had broken it, he began to
eat.

27:36 then were they all of good cheer, and they also took some meat.

27:37 and we were in all in the ship two hundr threescor and
sixteen souls.

27:38 and when they had eaten enough, they lighten the ship, and
cast out the wheat into the sea.

27:39 and when it wa day, they knew not the land: but they discovered
a certain creek with a shore, into the which they were minded, if it
wer possible, to thrust in the ship.

27:40 and when they had taken up the anchors, they committed
themselv unto the sea, and loos the rudder bands, and hois up
th mainsail to the wind, and made toward shore.

27:41 and fall into a place where two sea met, they ran the ship
aground; and the forepart stuck fast, and remain unmoveable, but the
hind part wa broken with the violenc of the waves.

27:42 and the soldiers' counsel wa to kill the prisoners, lest ani of
them should swim out, and escape.

27:43 but the centurion, will to save paul, kept them from their
purpose; and command that they which could swim should cast
themselv first into the sea, and get to land: 27:44 and the rest,
som on boards, and some on broken piec of the ship.

and so it came to pass, that they escap all safe to land.

28:1 and when they were escaped, then they knew that the island was
cal melita.

28:2 and the barbar peopl shew us no littl kindness: for they
kindl a fire, and receiv us everi one, becaus of the present
rain, and becaus of the cold.

28:3 and when paul had gather a bundl of sticks, and laid them on
th fire, there came a viper out of the heat, and fasten on his
hand.

28:4 and when the barbarian saw the venom beast hang on hi hand,
they said among themselves, No doubt thi man is a murderer, whom,
though he hath escap the sea, yet vengeanc suffereth not to live.

28:5 and he shook off the beast into the fire, and felt no harm.

28:6 howbeit they look when he should have swollen, or fallen down
dead suddenly: but after they had look a great while, and saw no
harm come to him, they chang their minds, and said that he wa a
god.

28:7 In the same quarter were possess of the chief man of the
island, whose name wa publius; who receiv us, and lodg us three
day courteously.

28:8 and it came to pass, that the father of publiu lay sick of a
fev and of a bloodi flux: to whom paul enter in, and prayed, and
laid hi hand on him, and heal him.

28:9 So when thi wa done, other also, which had diseas in the
island, came, and were healed: 28:10 who also honour us with many
honours; and when we departed, they lade us with such thing as were
necessary.

28:11 and after three month we depart in a ship of alexandria,
which had winter in the isle, whose sign wa castor and pollux.

28:12 and land at syracuse, we tarri there three days.

28:13 and from thenc we fetch a compass, and came to rhegium: and
aft one day the south wind blew, and we came the next day to
puteoli: 28:14 where we found brethren, and were desir to tarri with
them seven days: and so we went toward rome.

28:15 and from thence, when the brethren heard of us, they came to
meet us as far as appii forum, and the three taverns: whom when paul
saw, he thank god, and took courage.

28:16 and when we came to rome, the centurion deliv the prisoners
to the captain of the guard: but paul wa suffer to dwell by himself
with a soldier that kept him.

28:17 and it came to pass, that after three day paul call the chief
of the jew together: and when they were come together, he said unto
them, men and brethren, though I have commit noth against the
people, or custom of our fathers, yet wa I deliv prison from
jerusalem into the hand of the romans.

28:18 who, when they had examin me, would have let me go, because
ther wa no caus of death in me.

28:19 but when the jew spake against it, I wa constrain to appeal
unto caesar; not that I had ought to accus my nation of.

28:20 for thi caus therefor have I call for you, to see you, and
to speak with you: becaus that for the hope of israel I am bound with
thi chain.

28:21 and they said unto him, We neither receiv letter out of
judaea concern thee, neither ani of the brethren that came shewed
or spake ani harm of thee.

28:22 but we desir to hear of thee what thou thinkest: for as
concern thi sect, we know that everi where it is spoken against.

28:23 and when they had appoint him a day, there came mani to him
into hi lodging; to whom he expound and testifi the kingdom of
god, persuad them concern jesus, both out of the law of moses,
and out of the prophets, from morn till evening.

28:24 and some believ the thing which were spoken, and some
believ not.

28:25 and when they agre not among themselves, they departed, after
that paul had spoken one word, well spake the holi ghost by esaia the
prophet unto our fathers, 28:26 saying, Go unto thi people, and say,
hear ye shall hear, and shall not understand; and see ye shall
see, and not perceive: 28:27 for the heart of thi peopl is waxed
gross, and their ear are dull of hearing, and their eye have they
closed; lest they should see with their eyes, and hear with their
ears, and understand with their heart, and should be converted, and i
should heal them.

28:28 Be it known therefor unto you, that the salvat of god is
sent unto the gentiles, and that they will hear it.

28:29 and when he had said these words, the jew departed, and had
great reason among themselves.

28:30 and paul dwelt two whole year in hi own hire house, and
receiv all that came in unto him, 28:31 preach the kingdom of
god, and teach those thing which concern the lord jesu christ,
with all confidence, no man forbid him.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the romans


1:1 paul, a servant of jesu christ, call to be an apostle,
separ unto the gospel of god, 1:2 (which he had promis afor by
hi prophet in the holi scriptures,) 1:3 concern hi son jesus
christ our lord, which wa made of the seed of david accord to the
flesh; 1:4 and declar to be the son of god with power, accord to
th spirit of holiness, by the resurrect from the dead: 1:5 By whom
w have receiv grace and apostleship, for obedi to the faith
among all nations, for hi name: 1:6 among whom are ye also the called
of jesu christ: 1:7 To all that be in rome, belov of god, call to
b saints: grace to you and peac from god our father, and the lord
jesu christ.

1:8 first, I thank my god through jesu christ for you all, that your
faith is spoken of throughout the whole world.

1:9 for god is my witness, whom I serv with my spirit in the gospel
of hi son, that without ceas I make mention of you alway in my
prayers; 1:10 make request, if by ani mean now at length I might
hav a prosper journey by the will of god to come unto you.

1:11 for I long to see you, that I may impart unto you some spiritual
gift, to the end ye may be established; 1:12 that is, that I may be
comfort togeth with you by the mutual faith both of you and me.

1:13 now I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that oftentim i
purpos to come unto you, (but wa let hitherto,) that I might have
som fruit among you also, even as among other gentiles.

1:14 I am debtor both to the greeks, and to the barbarians; both to
th wise, and to the unwise.

1:15 so, as much as in me is, I am readi to preach the gospel to you
that are at rome also.

1:16 for I am not asham of the gospel of christ: for it is the power
of god unto salvat to everi one that believeth; to the jew first,
and also to the greek.

1:17 for therein is the righteous of god reveal from faith to
faith: as it is written, the just shall live by faith.

1:18 for the wrath of god is reveal from heaven against all
ungodli and unright of men, who hold the truth in
unrighteousness; 1:19 becaus that which may be known of god is
manifest in them; for god hath shew it unto them.

1:20 for the invis thing of him from the creation of the world
ar clearli seen, be understood by the thing that are made, even
hi etern power and godhead; so that they are without excuse: 1:21
becaus that, when they knew god, they glorifi him not as god,
neith were thankful; but becam vain in their imaginations, and
their foolish heart wa darkened.

1:22 profess themselv to be wise, they becam fools, 1:23 and
chang the glori of the uncorrupt god into an imag made like to
corrupt man, and to birds, and fourfoot beasts, and creeping
things.

1:24 wherefor god also gave them up to unclean through the lusts
of their own hearts, to dishonour their own bodi between themselves:
1:25 who chang the truth of god into a lie, and worship and
serv the creatur more than the creator, who is bless for ever.
amen.

1:26 for thi caus god gave them up unto vile affections: for even
their women did chang the natur use into that which is against
nature: 1:27 and likewis also the men, leav the natur use of the
woman, burn in their lust one toward another; men with men working
that which is unseemly, and receiv in themselv that recomp of
their error which wa meet.

1:28 and even as they did not like to retain god in their knowledge,
god gave them over to a reprob mind, to do those thing which are
not convenient; 1:29 be fill with all unrighteousness,
fornication, wickedness, covetousness, maliciousness; full of envy,
murder, debate, deceit, malignity; whisperers, 1:30 backbiters, haters
of god, despiteful, proud, boasters, inventor of evil things,
disobedi to parents, 1:31 without understanding, covenantbreakers,
without natur affection, implacable, unmerciful: 1:32 who knowing
th judgment of god, that they which commit such thing are worthi of
death, not onli do the same, but have pleasur in them that do them.

2:1 therefor thou art inexcusable, O man, whosoev thou art that
judgest: for wherein thou judgest another, thou condemnest thyself;
for thou that judgest doest the same things.

2:2 but we are sure that the judgment of god is accord to truth
against them which commit such things.

2:3 and thinkest thou this, O man, that judgest them which do such
things, and doest the same, that thou shalt escap the judgment of
god?  2:4 Or despisest thou the rich of hi good and forbearance
and longsuffering; not know that the good of god leadeth thee
to repentance?  2:5 but after thi hard and impenit heart
treasurest up unto thyself wrath against the day of wrath and
revel of the righteou judgment of god; 2:6 who will render to
everi man accord to hi deeds: 2:7 To them who by patient
continu in well do seek for glori and honour and immortality,
etern life: 2:8 but unto them that are contentious, and do not obey
th truth, but obey unrighteousness, indign and wrath, 2:9
tribul and anguish, upon everi soul of man that doeth evil, of
th jew first, and also of the gentile; 2:10 but glory, honour, and
peace, to everi man that worketh good, to the jew first, and also to
th gentile: 2:11 for there is no respect of person with god.

2:12 for as mani as have sin without law shall also perish without
law: and as mani as have sin in the law shall be judg by the law;
2:13 (for not the hearer of the law are just befor god, but the
doer of the law shall be justified.

2:14 for when the gentiles, which have not the law, do by natur the
th contain in the law, these, have not the law, are a law unto
themselves: 2:15 which shew the work of the law written in their
hearts, their conscienc also bear witness, and their thought the
mean while accus or els excus one another;) 2:16 In the day
when god shall judg the secret of men by jesu christ accord to
mi gospel.

2:17 behold, thou art call a jew, and restest in the law, and makest
thi boast of god, 2:18 and knowest hi will, and approvest the things
that are more excellent, be instruct out of the law; 2:19 and art
confid that thou thyself art a guid of the blind, a light of them
which are in darkness, 2:20 An instructor of the foolish, a teacher of
babes, which hast the form of knowledg and of the truth in the law.

2:21 thou therefor which teachest another, teachest thou not thyself?
th that preachest a man should not steal, dost thou steal?  2:22
thou that sayest a man should not commit adultery, dost thou commit
adultery? thou that abhorrest idols, dost thou commit sacrilege?  2:23
thou that makest thi boast of the law, through break the law
dishonourest thou god?  2:24 for the name of god is blasphem among
th gentil through you, as it is written.

2:25 for circumcis verili profiteth, if thou keep the law: but if
thou be a breaker of the law, thi circumcis is made uncircumcision.

2:26 therefor if the uncircumcis keep the righteous of the
law, shall not hi uncircumcis be count for circumcision?  2:27
and shall not uncircumcis which is by nature, if it fulfil the law,
judg thee, who by the letter and circumcis dost transgress the
law?  2:28 for he is not a jew, which is one outwardly; neither is
that circumcision, which is outward in the flesh: 2:29 but he is a
jew, which is one inwardly; and circumcis is that of the heart, in
th spirit, and not in the letter; whose prais is not of men, but of
god.

3:1 what advantag then hath the jew? or what profit is there of
circumcision?  3:2 much everi way: chiefly, becaus that unto them
wer commit the oracl of god.

3:3 for what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the
faith of god without effect?  3:4 god forbid: yea, let god be true,
but everi man a liar; as it is written, that thou mightest be
justifi in thi sayings, and mightest overcom when thou art judged.

3:5 but if our unright commend the righteous of god, what
shal we say? Is god unright who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a
man) 3:6 god forbid: for then how shall god judg the world?  3:7 for
if the truth of god hath more abound through my lie unto hi glory;
whi yet am I also judg as a sinner?  3:8 and not rather, (a we be
slander reported, and as some affirm that we say,) let us do
evil, that good may come? whose damnat is just.

3:9 what then? are we better than they? no, in no wise: for we have
befor prove both jew and gentiles, that they are all under sin;
3:10 As it is written, there is none righteous, no, not one: 3:11
there is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after
god.

3:12 they are all gone out of the way, they are togeth become
unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

3:13 their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongu they have
us deceit; the poison of asp is under their lips: 3:14 whose mouth
i full of curs and bitterness: 3:15 their feet are swift to shed
blood: 3:16 destruct and miseri are in their ways: 3:17 and the way
of peac have they not known: 3:18 there is no fear of god before
their eyes.

3:19 now we know that what thing soever the law saith, it saith to
them who are under the law: that everi mouth may be stopped, and all
th world may becom guilti befor god.

3:20 therefor by the deed of the law there shall no flesh be
justifi in hi sight: for by the law is the knowledg of sin.

3:21 but now the righteous of god without the law is manifested,
b wit by the law and the prophets; 3:22 even the
right of god which is by faith of jesu christ unto all and
upon all them that believe: for there is no difference: 3:23 for all
hav sinned, and come short of the glori of god; 3:24 be justified
fre by hi grace through the redempt that is in christ jesus:
3:25 whom god hath set forth to be a propiti through faith in his
blood, to declar hi righteous for the remiss of sin that are
past, through the forbear of god; 3:26 To declare, I say, at this
tim hi righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifi of
him which believeth in jesus.

3:27 where is boast then? It is excluded. By what law? of works?
nay: but by the law of faith.

3:28 therefor we conclud that a man is justifi by faith without
th deed of the law.

3:29 Is he the god of the jew only? is he not also of the gentiles?
yes, of the gentil also: 3:30 see it is one god, which shall
justifi the circumcis by faith, and uncircumcis through faith.

3:31 Do we then make void the law through faith? god forbid: yea, we
establish the law.

4:1 what shall we say then that abraham our father, as pertain to
th flesh, hath found?  4:2 for if abraham were justifi by works, he
hath whereof to glory; but not befor god.

4:3 for what saith the scripture? abraham believ god, and it was
count unto him for righteousness.

4:4 now to him that worketh is the reward not reckon of grace, but
of debt.

4:5 but to him that worketh not, but believeth on him that justifieth
th ungodly, hi faith is count for righteousness.

4:6 even as david also describeth the blessed of the man, unto
whom god imputeth righteous without works, 4:7 saying, bless are
they whose iniqu are forgiven, and whose sin are covered.

4:8 bless is the man to whom the lord will not imput sin.

4:9 cometh thi blessed then upon the circumcis only, or upon
th uncircumcis also? for we say that faith wa reckon to abraham
for righteousness.

4:10 how wa it then reckoned? when he wa in circumcision, or in
uncircumcision? not in circumcision, but in uncircumcision.

4:11 and he receiv the sign of circumcision, a seal of the
right of the faith which he had yet be uncircumcised: that
h might be the father of all them that believe, though they be not
circumcised; that righteous might be imput unto them also: 4:12
and the father of circumcis to them who are not of the circumcision
only, but who also walk in the step of that faith of our father
abraham, which he had be yet uncircumcised.

4:13 for the promise, that he should be the heir of the world, wa not
to abraham, or to hi seed, through the law, but through the
right of faith.

4:14 for if they which are of the law be heirs, faith is made void,
and the promis made of none effect: 4:15 becaus the law worketh
wrath: for where no law is, there is no transgression.

4:16 therefor it is of faith, that it might be by grace; to the end
th promis might be sure to all the seed; not to that onli which is
of the law, but to that also which is of the faith of abraham; who is
th father of us all, 4:17 (a it is written, I have made thee a
fath of mani nations,) befor him whom he believed, even god, who
quickeneth the dead, and calleth those thing which be not as though
they were.

4:18 who against hope believ in hope, that he might becom the
fath of mani nations, accord to that which wa spoken, So shall
thi seed be.

4:19 and be not weak in faith, he consid not hi own bodi now
dead, when he wa about an hundr year old, neither yet the deadness
of sarah' womb: 4:20 He stagger not at the promis of god through
unbelief; but wa strong in faith, give glori to god; 4:21 and being
 persuad that, what he had promised, he wa abl also to
perform.

4:22 and therefor it wa imput to him for righteousness.

4:23 now it wa not written for hi sake alone, that it wa imput to
him; 4:24 but for us also, to whom it shall be imputed, if we believe
on him that rais up jesu our lord from the dead; 4:25 who was
deliv for our offences, and wa rais again for our
justification.

5:1 therefor be justifi by faith, we have peac with god through
our lord jesu christ: 5:2 By whom also we have access by faith into
thi grace wherein we stand, and rejoic in hope of the glori of god.

5:3 and not onli so, but we glori in tribul also: know that
tribul worketh patience; 5:4 and patience, experience; and
experience, hope: 5:5 and hope maketh not ashamed; becaus the love of
god is shed abroad in our heart by the holi ghost which is given unto
us.

5:6 for when we were yet without strength, in due time christ die for
th ungodly.

5:7 for scarc for a righteou man will one die: yet peradventure
for a good man some would even dare to die.

5:8 but god commendeth hi love toward us, in that, while we were yet
sinners, christ die for us.

5:9 much more then, be now justifi by hi blood, we shall be
sav from wrath through him.

5:10 for if, when we were enemies, we were reconcil to god by the
death of hi son, much more, be reconciled, we shall be save by
hi life.

5:11 and not onli so, but we also joy in god through our lord jesus
christ, by whom we have now receiv the atonement.

5:12 wherefore, as by one man sin enter into the world, and death by
sin; and so death pass upon all men, for that all have sinned: 5:13
(for until the law sin wa in the world: but sin is not imput when
ther is no law.

5:14 nevertheless death reign from adam to moses, even over them
that had not sin after the similitud of adam' transgression, who
i the figur of him that wa to come.

5:15 but not as the offence, so also is the free gift. for if through
th offenc of one mani be dead, much more the grace of god, and the
gift by grace, which is by one man, jesu christ, hath abound unto
many.

5:16 and not as it wa by one that sinned, so is the gift: for the
judg wa by one to condemnation, but the free gift is of many
off unto justification.

5:17 for if by one man' offenc death reign by one; much more they
which receiv abund of grace and of the gift of righteousness
shal reign in life by one, jesu christ.)  5:18 therefor as by the
off of one judgment came upon all men to condemnation; even so by
th righteous of one the free gift came upon all men unto
justif of life.

5:19 for as by one man' disobedi mani were made sinners, so by
th obedi of one shall mani be made righteous.

5:20 moreov the law entered, that the offenc might abound. but
wher sin abounded, grace did much more abound: 5:21 that as sin hath
reign unto death, even so might grace reign through righteousness
unto etern life by jesu christ our lord.

6:1 what shall we say then? shall we continu in sin, that grace may
abound?  6:2 god forbid. how shall we, that are dead to sin, live any
long therein?  6:3 know ye not, that so mani of us as were baptized
into jesu christ were baptiz into hi death?  6:4 therefor we are
buri with him by baptism into death: that like as christ wa raised
up from the dead by the glori of the father, even so we also should
walk in new of life.

6:5 for if we have been plant togeth in the like of hi death,
w shall be also in the like of hi resurrection: 6:6 knowing
this, that our old man is crucifi with him, that the bodi of sin
might be destroyed, that henceforth we should not serv sin.

6:7 for he that is dead is freed from sin.

6:8 now if we be dead with christ, we believ that we shall also live
with him: 6:9 know that christ be rais from the dead dieth no
more; death hath no more dominion over him.

6:10 for in that he died, he die unto sin once: but in that he
liveth, he liveth unto god.

6:11 likewis reckon ye also yourselv to be dead inde unto sin,
but aliv unto god through jesu christ our lord.

6:12 let not sin therefor reign in your mortal body, that ye should
obey it in the lust thereof.

6:13 neither yield ye your member as instrument of unrighteousness
unto sin: but yield yourselv unto god, as those that are aliv from
th dead, and your member as instrument of righteous unto god.

6:14 for sin shall not have dominion over you: for ye are not under
th law, but under grace.

6:15 what then? shall we sin, becaus we are not under the law, but
und grace? god forbid.

6:16 know ye not, that to whom ye yield yourselv servant to obey,
hi servant ye are to whom ye obey; whether of sin unto death, or of
obedi unto righteousness?  6:17 but god be thanked, that ye were
th servant of sin, but ye have obey from the heart that form of
doctrin which wa deliv you.

6:18 be then made free from sin, ye becam the servant of
righteousness.

6:19 I speak after the manner of men becaus of the infirm of your
flesh: for as ye have yield your member servant to unclean and
to iniqu unto iniquity; even so now yield your member servant to
right unto holiness.

6:20 for when ye were the servant of sin, ye were free from
righteousness.

6:21 what fruit had ye then in those thing whereof ye are now
ashamed?  for the end of those thing is death.

6:22 but now be made free from sin, and becom servant to god, ye
hav your fruit unto holiness, and the end everlast life.

6:23 for the wage of sin is death; but the gift of god is eternal
lif through jesu christ our lord.

7:1 know ye not, brethren, (for I speak to them that know the law,)
how that the law hath dominion over a man as long as he liveth?  7:2
for the woman which hath an husband is bound by the law to her husband
so long as he liveth; but if the husband be dead, she is loos from
th law of her husband.

7:3 So then if, while her husband liveth, she be marri to another
man, she shall be call an adulteress: but if her husband be dead,
sh is free from that law; so that she is no adulteress, though she be
marri to anoth man.

7:4 wherefore, my brethren, ye also are becom dead to the law by the
bodi of christ; that ye should be marri to another, even to him who
i rais from the dead, that we should bring forth fruit unto god.

7:5 for when we were in the flesh, the motion of sins, which were by
th law, did work in our member to bring forth fruit unto death.

7:6 but now we are deliv from the law, that be dead wherein we
wer held; that we should serv in new of spirit, and not in the
old of the letter.

7:7 what shall we say then? Is the law sin? god forbid. nay, I had not
known sin, but by the law: for I had not known lust, except the law
had said, thou shalt not covet.

7:8 but sin, take occas by the commandment, wrought in me all
mann of concupiscence. for without the law sin wa dead.

7:9 for I wa aliv without the law once: but when the commandment
came, sin revived, and I died.

7:10 and the commandment, which wa ordain to life, I found to be
unto death.

7:11 for sin, take occas by the commandment, deceiv me, and by
it slew me.

7:12 wherefor the law is holy, and the command holy, and just,
and good.

7:13 wa then that which is good made death unto me? god forbid. but
sin, that it might appear sin, work death in me by that which is
good; that sin by the command might becom exceed sinful.

7:14 for we know that the law is spiritual: but I am carnal, sold
und sin.

7:15 for that which I do I allow not: for what I would, that do I not;
but what I hate, that do i.

7:16 If then I do that which I would not, I consent unto the law that
it is good.

7:17 now then it is no more I that do it, but sin that dwelleth in me.

7:18 for I know that in me (that is, in my flesh,) dwelleth no good
thing: for to will is present with me; but how to perform that which
i good I find not.

7:19 for the good that I would I do not: but the evil which I would
not, that I do.

7:20 now if I do that I would not, it is no more I that do it, but sin
that dwelleth in me.

7:21 I find then a law, that, when I would do good, evil is present
with me.

7:22 for I delight in the law of god after the inward man: 7:23 but i
se anoth law in my members, war against the law of my mind, and
bring me into captiv to the law of sin which is in my members.

7:24 O wretch man that I am! who shall deliv me from the bodi of
thi death?  7:25 I thank god through jesu christ our lord. So then
with the mind I myself serv the law of god; but with the flesh the
law of sin.

8:1 there is therefor now no condemn to them which are in christ
jesus, who walk not after the flesh, but after the spirit.

8:2 for the law of the spirit of life in christ jesu hath made me
fre from the law of sin and death.

8:3 for what the law could not do, in that it wa weak through the
flesh, god send hi own son in the like of sin flesh, and
for sin, condemn sin in the flesh: 8:4 that the righteous of the
law might be fulfil in us, who walk not after the flesh, but after
th spirit.

8:5 for they that are after the flesh do mind the thing of the flesh;
but they that are after the spirit the thing of the spirit.

8:6 for to be carnal mind is death; but to be spiritu minded
i life and peace.

8:7 becaus the carnal mind is enmiti against god: for it is not
subject to the law of god, neither inde can be.

8:8 So then they that are in the flesh cannot pleas god.

8:9 but ye are not in the flesh, but in the spirit, if so be that the
spirit of god dwell in you. now if ani man have not the spirit of
christ, he is none of his.

8:10 and if christ be in you, the bodi is dead becaus of sin; but the
spirit is life becaus of righteousness.

8:11 but if the spirit of him that rais up jesu from the dead dwell
in you, he that rais up christ from the dead shall also quicken your
mort bodi by hi spirit that dwelleth in you.

8:12 therefore, brethren, we are debtors, not to the flesh, to live
aft the flesh.

8:13 for if ye live after the flesh, ye shall die: but if ye through
th spirit do mortifi the deed of the body, ye shall live.

8:14 for as mani as are led by the spirit of god, they are the son of
god.

8:15 for ye have not receiv the spirit of bondag again to fear; but
y have receiv the spirit of adoption, wherebi we cry, abba, father.

8:16 the spirit itself beareth wit with our spirit, that we are
th children of god: 8:17 and if children, then heirs; heir of god,
and joint-heir with christ; if so be that we suffer with him, that we
may be also glorifi together.

8:18 for I reckon that the suffer of thi present time are not
worthi to be compar with the glori which shall be reveal in us.

8:19 for the earnest expect of the creatur waiteth for the
manifest of the son of god.

8:20 for the creatur wa made subject to vanity, not willingly, but
bi reason of him who hath subject the same in hope, 8:21 becaus the
creatur itself also shall be deliv from the bondag of corruption
into the gloriou liberti of the children of god.

8:22 for we know that the whole creation groaneth and travaileth in
pain togeth until now.

8:23 and not onli they, but ourselv also, which have the firstfruits
of the spirit, even we ourselv groan within ourselves, wait for
th adoption, to wit, the redempt of our body.

8:24 for we are save by hope: but hope that is seen is not hope: for
what a man seeth, whi doth he yet hope for?  8:25 but if we hope for
that we see not, then do we with patienc wait for it.

8:26 likewis the spirit also helpeth our infirmities: for we know not
what we should pray for as we ought: but the spirit itself maketh
intercess for us with groan which cannot be uttered.

8:27 and he that searcheth the heart knoweth what is the mind of the
spirit, becaus he maketh intercess for the saint accord to the
wil of god.

8:28 and we know that all thing work togeth for good to them that
lov god, to them who are the call accord to hi purpose.

8:29 for whom he did foreknow, he also did predestin to be
conform to the imag of hi son, that he might be the firstborn
among mani brethren.

8:30 moreov whom he did predestinate, them he also called: and whom
h called, them he also justified: and whom he justified, them he also
glorified.

8:31 what shall we then say to these things? If god be for us, who can
b against us?  8:32 He that spare not hi own son, but deliv him
up for us all, how shall he not with him also freeli give us all
things?  8:33 who shall lay ani thing to the charg of god' elect? it
i god that justifieth.

8:34 who is he that condemneth? It is christ that died, yea rather,
that is risen again, who is even at the right hand of god, who also
maketh intercess for us.

8:35 who shall separ us from the love of christ? shall tribulation,
or distress, or persecution, or famine, or nakedness, or peril, or
sword?  8:36 As it is written, for thi sake we are kill all the day
long; we are account as sheep for the slaughter.

8:37 nay, in all these thing we are more than conqueror through him
that love us.

8:38 for I am persuaded, that neither death, nor life, nor angels, nor
principalities, nor powers, nor thing present, nor thing to come,
8:39 nor height, nor depth, nor ani other creature, shall be abl to
separ us from the love of god, which is in christ jesu our lord.

9:1 I say the truth in christ, I lie not, my conscienc also bearing
m wit in the holi ghost, 9:2 that I have great heavi and
continu sorrow in my heart.

9:3 for I could wish that myself were accurs from christ for my
brethren, my kinsmen accord to the flesh: 9:4 who are israelites;
to whom pertaineth the adoption, and the glory, and the covenants, and
th give of the law, and the servic of god, and the promises; 9:5
whose are the fathers, and of whom as concern the flesh christ
came, who is over all, god bless for ever. amen.

9:6 not as though the word of god hath taken none effect. for they are
not all israel, which are of israel: 9:7 neither, becaus they are the
se of abraham, are they all children: but, In isaac shall thi seed
b called.

9:8 that is, they which are the children of the flesh, these are not
th children of god: but the children of the promis are count for
th seed.

9:9 for thi is the word of promise, At thi time will I come, and
sarah shall have a son.

9:10 and not onli this; but when rebecca also had conceiv by one,
even by our father isaac; 9:11 (for the children be not yet born,
neith have done ani good or evil, that the purpos of god
accord to elect might stand, not of works, but of him that
calleth;) 9:12 It wa said unto her, the elder shall serv the
younger.

9:13 As it is written, jacob have I loved, but esau have I hated.

9:14 what shall we say then? Is there unright with god? god
forbid.

9:15 for he saith to moses, I will have merci on whom I will have
mercy, and I will have compass on whom I will have compassion.

9:16 So then it is not of him that willeth, nor of him that runneth,
but of god that sheweth mercy.

9:17 for the scriptur saith unto pharaoh, even for thi same purpose
hav I rais thee up, that I might shew my power in thee, and that my
nam might be declar throughout all the earth.

9:18 therefor hath he merci on whom he will have mercy, and whom he
wil he hardeneth.

9:19 thou wilt say then unto me, whi doth he yet find fault? for who
hath resist hi will?  9:20 nay but, O man, who art thou that
repliest against god? shall the thing form say to him that formed
it, whi hast thou made me thus?  9:21 hath not the potter power over
th clay, of the same lump to make one vessel unto honour, and another
unto dishonour?  9:22 what if god, will to shew hi wrath, and to
mak hi power known, endur with much longsuff the vessel of
wrath fit to destruction: 9:23 and that he might make known the
rich of hi glori on the vessel of mercy, which he had afore
prepar unto glory, 9:24 even us, whom he hath called, not of the
jew only, but also of the gentiles?  9:25 As he saith also in osee, i
wil call them my people, which were not my people; and her beloved,
which wa not beloved.

9:26 and it shall come to pass, that in the place where it wa said
unto them, Ye are not my people; there shall they be call the
children of the live god.

9:27 esaia also crieth concern israel, though the number of the
children of israel be as the sand of the sea, a remnant shall be
saved: 9:28 for he will finish the work, and cut it short in
righteousness: becaus a short work will the lord make upon the earth.

9:29 and as esaia said before, except the lord of sabaoth had left us
a seed, we had been as sodoma, and been made like unto gomorrha.

9:30 what shall we say then? that the gentiles, which follow not
aft righteousness, have attain to righteousness, even the
right which is of faith.

9:31 but israel, which follow after the law of righteousness, hath
not attain to the law of righteousness.

9:32 wherefore? becaus they sought it not by faith, but as it were by
th work of the law. for they stumbl at that stumblingstone; 9:33
a it is written, behold, I lay in sion a stumblingston and rock of
offence: and whosoev believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

10:1 brethren, my heart' desir and prayer to god for israel is, that
they might be saved.

10:2 for I bear them record that they have a zeal of god, but not
accord to knowledge.

10:3 for they be ignor of god' righteousness, and go about
to establish their own righteousness, have not submit themselves
unto the righteous of god.

10:4 for christ is the end of the law for righteous to everi one
that believeth.

10:5 for mose describeth the righteous which is of the law, that
th man which doeth those thing shall live by them.

10:6 but the righteous which is of faith speaketh on thi wise,
say not in thine heart, who shall ascend into heaven? (that is, to
br christ down from above:) 10:7 or, who shall descend into the
deep? (that is, to bring up christ again from the dead.)  10:8 but
what saith it? the word is nigh thee, even in thi mouth, and in thy
heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach; 10:9 that if thou
shalt confess with thi mouth the lord jesus, and shalt believ in
thin heart that god hath rais him from the dead, thou shalt be
saved.

10:10 for with the heart man believeth unto righteousness; and with
th mouth confess is made unto salvation.

10:11 for the scriptur saith, whosoev believeth on him shall not be
ashamed.

10:12 for there is no differ between the jew and the greek: for
th same lord over all is rich unto all that call upon him.

10:13 for whosoev shall call upon the name of the lord shall be
saved.

10:14 how then shall they call on him in whom they have not believed?
and how shall they believ in him of whom they have not heard? and how
shal they hear without a preacher?  10:15 and how shall they preach,
except they be sent? as it is written, how beauti are the feet of
them that preach the gospel of peace, and bring glad tide of good
things!  10:16 but they have not all obey the gospel. for esaias
saith, lord, who hath believ our report?  10:17 So then faith cometh
bi hearing, and hear by the word of god.

10:18 but I say, have they not heard? ye verily, their sound went
into all the earth, and their word unto the end of the world.

10:19 but I say, did not israel know? first mose saith, I will
provok you to jealousi by them that are no people, and by a foolish
n I will anger you.

10:20 but esaia is veri bold, and saith, I wa found of them that
sought me not; I wa made manifest unto them that ask not after me.

10:21 but to israel he saith, all day long I have stretch forth my
hand unto a disobedi and gainsay people.

11:1 I say then, hath god cast away hi people? god forbid. for I also
am an israelite, of the seed of abraham, of the tribe of benjamin.

11:2 god hath not cast away hi peopl which he foreknew. wot ye not
what the scriptur saith of elias? how he maketh intercess to god
against israel saying, 11:3 lord, they have kill thi prophets, and
dig down thine altars; and I am left alone, and they seek my life.

11:4 but what saith the answer of god unto him? I have reserv to
myself seven thousand men, who have not bow the knee to the imag of
baal.

11:5 even so then at thi present time also there is a remnant
accord to the elect of grace.

11:6 and if by grace, then is it no more of works: otherwis grace is
no more grace. but if it be of works, then it is no more grace:
otherwis work is no more work.

11:7 what then? israel hath not obtain that which he seeketh for;
but the elect hath obtain it, and the rest were blinded.

11:8 (accord as it is written, god hath given them the spirit of
slumber, eye that they should not see, and ear that they should not
hear;) unto thi day.

11:9 and david saith, let their tabl be made a snare, and a trap, and
a stumblingblock, and a recomp unto them: 11:10 let their eye be
darkened, that they may not see, and bow down their back alway.

11:11 I say then, have they stumbl that they should fall? god
forbid: but rather through their fall salvat is come unto the
gentiles, for to provok them to jealousy.

11:12 now if the fall of them be the rich of the world, and the
diminish of them the rich of the gentiles; how much more their
fulness?  11:13 for I speak to you gentiles, inasmuch as I am the
apostl of the gentiles, I magnifi mine office: 11:14 If by ani means
i may provok to emul them which are my flesh, and might save
som of them.

11:15 for if the cast away of them be the reconcil of the world,
what shall the receiv of them be, but life from the dead?  11:16
for if the firstfruit be holy, the lump is also holy: and if the root
b holy, so are the branches.
