11:17 and if some of the branch be broken off, and thou, be a
wild oliv tree, wert graf in among them, and with them partakest
of the root and fat of the oliv tree; 11:18 boast not against the
branches. but if thou boast, thou bearest not the root, but the root
thee.

11:19 thou wilt say then, the branch were broken off, that I might
b graf in.

11:20 well; becaus of unbelief they were broken off, and thou
standest by faith. Be not highminded, but fear: 11:21 for if god
spar not the natur branches, take heed lest he also spare not
thee.

11:22 behold therefor the good and sever of god: on them which
fell, severity; but toward thee, goodness, if thou continu in his
goodness: otherwis thou also shalt be cut off.

11:23 and they also, if they abid not still in unbelief, shall be
graf in: for god is abl to graff them in again.

11:24 for if thou wert cut out of the oliv tree which is wild by
nature, and wert graf contrari to natur into a good oliv tree:
how much more shall these, which be the natur branches, be graffed
into their own oliv tree?  11:25 for I would not, brethren, that ye
should be ignor of thi mystery, lest ye should be wise in your own
conceits; that blind in part is happen to israel, until the
 of the gentil be come in.

11:26 and so all israel shall be saved: as it is written, there shall
com out of sion the deliverer, and shall turn away ungodli from
jacob: 11:27 for thi is my coven unto them, when I shall take away
their sins.

11:28 As concern the gospel, they are enemi for your sakes: but
a touch the election, they are belov for the father' sakes.

11:29 for the gift and call of god are without repentance.

11:30 for as ye in time past have not believ god, yet have now
obtain merci through their unbelief: 11:31 even so have these also
now not believed, that through your merci they also may obtain mercy.

11:32 for god hath conclud them all in unbelief, that he might have
merci upon all.

11:33 O the depth of the rich both of the wisdom and knowledg of
god!  how unsearch are hi judgments, and hi way past finding
out!  11:34 for who hath known the mind of the lord? or who hath been
hi counsellor?  11:35 Or who hath first given to him, and it shall be
recompens unto him again?  11:36 for of him, and through him, and to
him, are all things: to whom be glori for ever. amen.

12:1 I beseech you therefore, brethren, by the merci of god, that ye
pres your bodi a live sacrifice, holy, accept unto god,
which is your reason service.

12:2 and be not conform to thi world: but be ye transform by the
renew of your mind, that ye may prove what is that good, and
acceptable, and perfect, will of god.

12:3 for I say, through the grace given unto me, to everi man that is
among you, not to think of himself more highli than he ought to think;
but to think soberly, accord as god hath dealt to everi man the
measur of faith.

12:4 for as we have mani member in one body, and all member have not
th same office: 12:5 So we, be many, are one bodi in christ, and
everi one member one of another.

12:6 have then gift differ accord to the grace that is given
to us, whether prophecy, let us prophesi accord to the proportion
of faith; 12:7 Or ministry, let us wait on our ministering: or he that
teacheth, on teaching; 12:8 Or he that exhorteth, on exhortation: he
that giveth, let him do it with simplicity; he that ruleth, with
diligence; he that sheweth mercy, with cheerfulness.

12:9 let love be without dissimulation. abhor that which is evil;
cleav to that which is good.

12:10 Be kindli affect one to anoth with brotherli love; in
honour prefer one another; 12:11 not sloth in business; fervent
in spirit; serv the lord; 12:12 rejoic in hope; patient in
tribulation; continu instant in prayer; 12:13 distribut to the
necess of saints; given to hospitality.

12:14 bless them which persecut you: bless, and curs not.

12:15 rejoic with them that do rejoice, and weep with them that weep.

12:16 Be of the same mind one toward another. mind not high things,
but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

12:17 recompens to no man evil for evil. provid thing honest in the
sight of all men.

12:18 If it be possible, as much as lieth in you, live peaceabl with
al men.

12:19 dearli beloved, aveng not yourselves, but rather give place
unto wrath: for it is written, vengeanc is mine; I will repay, saith
th lord.

12:20 therefor if thine enemi hunger, feed him; if he thirst, give
him drink: for in so do thou shalt heap coal of fire on hi head.

12:21 Be not overcom of evil, but overcom evil with good.

13:1 let everi soul be subject unto the higher powers. for there is no
pow but of god: the power that be are ordain of god.

13:2 whosoev therefor resisteth the power, resisteth the ordinance
of god: and they that resist shall receiv to themselv damnation.

13:3 for ruler are not a terror to good works, but to the evil. wilt
thou then not be afraid of the power? do that which is good, and thou
shalt have prais of the same: 13:4 for he is the minist of god to
the for good. but if thou do that which is evil, be afraid; for he
beareth not the sword in vain: for he is the minist of god, a
reveng to execut wrath upon him that doeth evil.

13:5 wherefor ye must need be subject, not onli for wrath, but also
for conscienc sake.

13:6 for for thi caus pay ye tribut also: for they are god's
ministers, attend continu upon thi veri thing.

13:7 render therefor to all their dues: tribut to whom tribut is
due; custom to whom custom; fear to whom fear; honour to whom honour.

13:8 owe no man ani thing, but to love one another: for he that loveth
anoth hath fulfil the law.

13:9 for this, thou shalt not commit adultery, thou shalt not kill,
thou shalt not steal, thou shalt not bear fals witness, thou shalt
not covet; and if there be ani other commandment, it is briefly
comprehend in thi saying, namely, thou shalt love thi neighbour as
thyself.

13:10 love worketh no ill to hi neighbour: therefor love is the
fulfil of the law.

13:11 and that, know the time, that now it is high time to awake
out of sleep: for now is our salvat nearer than when we believed.

13:12 the night is far spent, the day is at hand: let us therefore
cast off the work of darkness, and let us put on the armour of light.

13:13 let us walk honestly, as in the day; not in riot and
drunkenness, not in chamber and wantonness, not in strife and
envying.

13:14 but put ye on the lord jesu christ, and make not provis for
th flesh, to fulfil the lust thereof.

14:1 him that is weak in the faith receiv ye, but not to doubtful
disputations.

14:2 for one believeth that he may eat all things: another, who is
weak, eateth herbs.

14:3 let not him that eateth despis him that eateth not; and let not
him which eateth not judg him that eateth: for god hath receiv him.

14:4 who art thou that judgest anoth man' servant? to hi own
mast he standeth or falleth. yea, he shall be holden up: for god is
abl to make him stand.

14:5 one man esteemeth one day abov another: anoth esteemeth every
day alike. let everi man be fulli persuad in hi own mind.

14:6 He that regardeth the day, regardeth it unto the lord; and he
that regardeth not the day, to the lord he doth not regard it. He that
eateth, eateth to the lord, for he giveth god thanks; and he that
eateth not, to the lord he eateth not, and giveth god thanks.

14:7 for none of us liveth to himself, and no man dieth to himself.

14:8 for whether we live, we live unto the lord; and whether we die,
w die unto the lord: whether we live therefore, or die, we are the
lord's.

14:9 for to thi end christ both died, and rose, and revived, that he
might be lord both of the dead and living.

14:10 but whi dost thou judg thi brother? or whi dost thou set at
nought thi brother? for we shall all stand befor the judgment seat of
christ.

14:11 for it is written, As I live, saith the lord, everi knee shall
bow to me, and everi tongu shall confess to god.

14:12 So then everi one of us shall give account of himself to god.

14:13 let us not therefor judg one anoth ani more: but judg this
rather, that no man put a stumblingblock or an occas to fall in his
brother' way.

14:14 I know, and am persuad by the lord jesus, that there is
noth unclean of itself: but to him that esteemeth ani thing to be
unclean, to him it is unclean.

14:15 but if thi brother be griev with thi meat, now walkest thou
not charitably. destroy not him with thi meat, for whom christ died.

14:16 let not then your good be evil spoken of: 14:17 for the kingdom
of god is not meat and drink; but righteousness, and peace, and joy in
th holi ghost.

14:18 for he that in these thing serveth christ is accept to god,
and approv of men.

14:19 let us therefor follow after the thing which make for peace,
and thing wherewith one may edifi another.

14:20 for meat destroy not the work of god. all thing inde are
pure; but it is evil for that man who eateth with offence.

14:21 It is good neither to eat flesh, nor to drink wine, nor any
th wherebi thi brother stumbleth, or is offended, or is made weak.

14:22 hast thou faith? have it to thyself befor god. happi is he that
condemneth not himself in that thing which he alloweth.

14:23 and he that doubteth is damn if he eat, becaus he eateth not
of faith: for whatsoev is not of faith is sin.

15:1 We then that are strong ought to bear the infirm of the
weak, and not to pleas ourselves.

15:2 let everi one of us pleas hi neighbour for hi good to
edification.

15:3 for even christ pleas not himself; but, as it is written, the
reproach of them that reproach thee fell on me.

15:4 for whatsoev thing were written aforetim were written for our
learning, that we through patienc and comfort of the scriptur might
hav hope.

15:5 now the god of patienc and consol grant you to be
likemind one toward anoth accord to christ jesus: 15:6 that ye
may with one mind and one mouth glorifi god, even the father of our
lord jesu christ.

15:7 wherefor receiv ye one another, as christ also receiv us to
th glori of god.

15:8 now I say that jesu christ wa a minist of the circumcision
for the truth of god, to confirm the promis made unto the fathers:
15:9 and that the gentil might glorifi god for hi mercy; as it is
written, for thi caus I will confess to thee among the gentiles, and
s unto thi name.

15:10 and again he saith, rejoice, ye gentiles, with hi people.

15:11 and again, prais the lord, all ye gentiles; and laud him, all
y people.

15:12 and again, esaia saith, there shall be a root of jesse, and he
that shall rise to reign over the gentiles; in him shall the gentiles
trust.

15:13 now the god of hope fill you with all joy and peac in
believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the holy
ghost.

15:14 and I myself also am persuad of you, my brethren, that ye also
ar full of goodness, fill with all knowledge, abl also to admonish
on another.

15:15 nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldli unto you
in some sort, as put you in mind, becaus of the grace that is
given to me of god, 15:16 that I should be the minist of jesus
christ to the gentiles, minist the gospel of god, that the
off up of the gentil might be acceptable, be sanctifi by
th holi ghost.

15:17 I have therefor whereof I may glori through jesu christ in
thos thing which pertain to god.

15:18 for I will not dare to speak of ani of those thing which christ
hath not wrought by me, to make the gentil obedient, by word and
deed, 15:19 through mighti sign and wonders, by the power of the
spirit of god; so that from jerusalem, and round about unto illyricum,
i have fulli preach the gospel of christ.

15:20 yea, so have I strive to preach the gospel, not where christ
wa named, lest I should build upon anoth man' foundation: 15:21
but as it is written, To whom he wa not spoken of, they shall see:
and they that have not heard shall understand.

15:22 for which caus also I have been much hinder from come to
you.

15:23 but now have no more place in these parts, and have a great
desir these mani year to come unto you; 15:24 whensoev I take my
journey into spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my
journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be
somewhat fill with your company.

15:25 but now I go unto jerusalem to minist unto the saints.

15:26 for it hath pleas them of macedonia and achaia to make a
certain contribut for the poor saint which are at jerusalem.

15:27 It hath pleas them verily; and their debtor they are. for if
th gentil have been made partak of their spiritu things, their
duti is also to minist unto them in carnal things.

15:28 when therefor I have perform this, and have seal to them
thi fruit, I will come by you into spain.

15:29 and I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the
 of the bless of the gospel of christ.

15:30 now I beseech you, brethren, for the lord jesu christ' sake,
and for the love of the spirit, that ye strive togeth with me in
your prayer to god for me; 15:31 that I may be deliv from them
that do not believ in judaea; and that my servic which I have for
jerusalem may be accept of the saints; 15:32 that I may come unto
y with joy by the will of god, and may with you be refreshed.

15:33 now the god of peac be with you all. amen.

16:1 I commend unto you phebe our sister, which is a servant of the
church which is at cenchrea: 16:2 that ye receiv her in the lord, as
becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoev busi she
hath need of you: for she hath been a succour of many, and of myself
also.

16:3 greet priscilla and aquila my helper in christ jesus: 16:4 who
hav for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not onli I give
thanks, but also all the church of the gentiles.

16:5 likewis greet the church that is in their house. salut my
well-belov epaenetus, who is the firstfruit of achaia unto christ.

16:6 greet mary, who bestow much labour on us.

16:7 salut andronicu and junia, my kinsmen, and my fellow-prisoners,
who are of note among the apostles, who also were in christ befor me.

16:8 greet amplia my belov in the lord.

16:9 salut urbane, our helper in christ, and stachi my beloved.

16:10 salut apel approv in christ. salut them which are of
aristobulus' household.

16:11 salut herodion my kinsman. greet them that be of the household
of narcissus, which are in the lord.

16:12 salut tryphena and tryphosa, who labour in the lord. salut the
belov persis, which labour much in the lord.

16:13 salut rufu chosen in the lord, and hi mother and mine.

16:14 salut asyncritus, phlegon, hermas, patrobas, hermes, and the
brethren which are with them.

16:15 salut philologus, and julia, nereus, and hi sister, and
olympas, and all the saint which are with them.

16:16 salut one anoth with an holi kiss. the church of christ
salut you.

16:17 now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which caus divis and
off contrari to the doctrin which ye have learned; and avoid
them.

16:18 for they that are such serv not our lord jesu christ, but
their own belly; and by good word and fair speech deceiv the
heart of the simple.

16:19 for your obedi is come abroad unto all men. I am glad
therefor on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that
which is good, and simpl concern evil.

16:20 and the god of peac shall bruis satan under your feet shortly.
th grace of our lord jesu christ be with you. amen.

16:21 timotheu my workfellow, and lucius, and jason, and sosipater,
mi kinsmen, salut you.

16:22 I tertius, who wrote thi epistle, salut you in the lord.

16:23 gaiu mine host, and of the whole church, saluteth you. erastus
th chamberlain of the citi saluteth you, and quartu a brother.

16:24 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all. amen.

16:25 now to him that is of power to stablish you accord to my
gospel, and the preach of jesu christ, accord to the revelation
of the mystery, which wa kept secret sinc the world began, 16:26 but
now is made manifest, and by the scriptur of the prophets, according
to the command of the everlast god, made known to all nations
for the obedi of faith: 16:27 To god onli wise, be glori through
jesu christ for ever. amen.




th first epistl of paul the apostl to the corinthians


1:1 paul call to be an apostl of jesu christ through the will of
god, and sosthen our brother, 1:2 unto the church of god which is at
corinth, to them that are sanctifi in christ jesus, call to be
saints, with all that in everi place call upon the name of jesus
christ our lord, both their' and our's: 1:3 grace be unto you, and
peace, from god our father, and from the lord jesu christ.

1:4 I thank my god alway on your behalf, for the grace of god which
i given you by jesu christ; 1:5 that in everi thing ye are enriched
bi him, in all utterance, and in all knowledge; 1:6 even as the
testimoni of christ wa confirm in you: 1:7 So that ye come behind
in no gift; wait for the come of our lord jesu christ: 1:8 who
shal also confirm you unto the end, that ye may be blameless in the
day of our lord jesu christ.

1:9 god is faithful, by whom ye were call unto the fellowship of his
son jesu christ our lord.

1:10 now I beseech you, brethren, by the name of our lord jesus
christ, that ye all speak the same thing, and that there be no
divis among you; but that ye be perfectli join togeth in the
sam mind and in the same judgment.

1:11 for it hath been declar unto me of you, my brethren, by them
which are of the hous of chloe, that there are content among you.

1:12 now thi I say, that everi one of you saith, I am of paul; and i
of apollos; and I of cephas; and I of christ.

1:13 Is christ divided? wa paul crucifi for you? or were ye
bapt in the name of paul?  1:14 I thank god that I baptiz none
of you, but crispu and gaius; 1:15 lest ani should say that I had
bapt in mine own name.

1:16 and I baptiz also the household of stephanas: besides, I know
not whether I baptiz ani other.

1:17 for christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the gospel: not
with wisdom of words, lest the cross of christ should be made of none
effect.

1:18 for the preach of the cross is to them that perish
foolishness; but unto us which are save it is the power of god.

1:19 for it is written, I will destroy the wisdom of the wise, and
wil bring to noth the understand of the prudent.

1:20 where is the wise? where is the scribe? where is the disput of
thi world? hath not god made foolish the wisdom of thi world?  1:21
for after that in the wisdom of god the world by wisdom knew not god,
it pleas god by the foolish of preach to save them that
believe.

1:22 for the jew requir a sign, and the greek seek after wisdom:
1:23 but we preach christ crucified, unto the jew a stumblingblock,
and unto the greek foolishness; 1:24 but unto them which are called,
both jew and greeks, christ the power of god, and the wisdom of god.

1:25 becaus the foolish of god is wiser than men; and the
weak of god is stronger than men.

1:26 for ye see your calling, brethren, how that not mani wise men
aft the flesh, not mani mighty, not mani noble, are called: 1:27 but
god hath chosen the foolish thing of the world to confound the wise;
and god hath chosen the weak thing of the world to confound the
th which are mighty; 1:28 and base thing of the world, and things
which are despised, hath god chosen, yea, and thing which are not, to
br to nought thing that are: 1:29 that no flesh should glori in
hi presence.

1:30 but of him are ye in christ jesus, who of god is made unto us
wisdom, and righteousness, and sanctification, and redemption: 1:31
that, accord as it is written, He that glorieth, let him glori in
th lord.

2:1 and I, brethren, when I came to you, came not with excel of
speech or of wisdom, declar unto you the testimoni of god.

2:2 for I determin not to know ani thing among you, save jesus
christ, and him crucified.

2:3 and I wa with you in weakness, and in fear, and in much
trembling.

2:4 and my speech and my preach wa not with entic word of
man' wisdom, but in demonstr of the spirit and of power: 2:5
that your faith should not stand in the wisdom of men, but in the
pow of god.

2:6 howbeit we speak wisdom among them that are perfect: yet not the
wisdom of thi world, nor of the princ of thi world, that come to
nought: 2:7 but we speak the wisdom of god in a mystery, even the
hidden wisdom, which god ordain befor the world unto our glory: 2:8
which none of the princ of thi world knew: for had they known it,
they would not have crucifi the lord of glory.

2:9 but as it is written, eye hath not seen, nor ear heard, neither
hav enter into the heart of man, the thing which god hath prepared
for them that love him.

2:10 but god hath reveal them unto us by hi spirit: for the spirit
searcheth all things, yea, the deep thing of god.

2:11 for what man knoweth the thing of a man, save the spirit of man
which is in him? even so the thing of god knoweth no man, but the
spirit of god.

2:12 now we have received, not the spirit of the world, but the spirit
which is of god; that we might know the thing that are freeli given
to us of god.

2:13 which thing also we speak, not in the word which man' wisdom
teacheth, but which the holi ghost teacheth; compar spiritual
th with spiritual.

2:14 but the natur man receiveth not the thing of the spirit of
god: for they are foolish unto him: neither can he know them,
becaus they are spiritu discerned.

2:15 but he that is spiritu judgeth all things, yet he himself is
judg of no man.

2:16 for who hath known the mind of the lord, that he may instruct
him?  but we have the mind of christ.

3:1 and I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but
a unto carnal, even as unto babe in christ.

3:2 I have fed you with milk, and not with meat: for hitherto ye were
not abl to bear it, neither yet now are ye able.

3:3 for ye are yet carnal: for wherea there is among you envying, and
strife, and divisions, are ye not carnal, and walk as men?  3:4 for
whil one saith, I am of paul; and another, I am of apollos; are ye
not carnal?  3:5 who then is paul, and who is apollos, but ministers
bi whom ye believed, even as the lord gave to everi man?  3:6 I have
planted, apollo watered; but god gave the increase.

3:7 So then neither is he that planteth ani thing, neither he that
watereth; but god that giveth the increase.

3:8 now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: and everi man
shal receiv hi own reward accord to hi own labour.

3:9 for we are labour togeth with god: ye are god' husbandry, ye
ar god' building.

3:10 accord to the grace of god which is given unto me, as a wise
masterbuilder, I have laid the foundation, and anoth buildeth
thereon. but let everi man take heed how he buildeth thereupon.

3:11 for other foundat can no man lay than that is laid, which is
jesu christ.

3:12 now if ani man build upon thi foundat gold, silver, precious
stones, wood, hay, stubble; 3:13 everi man' work shall be made
manifest: for the day shall declar it, becaus it shall be revealed
bi fire; and the fire shall tri everi man' work of what sort it is.

3:14 If ani man' work abid which he hath built thereupon, he shall
rec a reward.

3:15 If ani man' work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he
himself shall be saved; yet so as by fire.

3:16 know ye not that ye are the templ of god, and that the spirit of
god dwelleth in you?  3:17 If ani man defil the templ of god, him
shal god destroy; for the templ of god is holy, which templ ye are.

3:18 let no man deceiv himself. If ani man among you seemeth to be
wis in thi world, let him becom a fool, that he may be wise.

3:19 for the wisdom of thi world is foolish with god. for it is
written, He taketh the wise in their own craftiness.

3:20 and again, the lord knoweth the thought of the wise, that they
ar vain.

3:21 therefor let no man glori in men. for all thing are your's;
3:22 whether paul, or apollos, or cephas, or the world, or life, or
death, or thing present, or thing to come; all are your's; 3:23 and
y are christ's; and christ is god's.

4:1 let a man so account of us, as of the minist of christ, and
steward of the mysteri of god.

4:2 moreov it is requir in stewards, that a man be found faithful.

4:3 but with me it is a veri small thing that I should be judg of
you, or of man' judgment: yea, I judg not mine own self.

4:4 for I know noth by myself; yet am I not herebi justified: but
h that judgeth me is the lord.

4:5 therefor judg noth befor the time, until the lord come, who
both will bring to light the hidden thing of darkness, and will make
manifest the counsel of the hearts: and then shall everi man have
prais of god.

4:6 and these things, brethren, I have in a figur transfer to
myself and to apollo for your sakes; that ye might learn in us not to
think of men abov that which is written, that no one of you be puffed
up for one against another.

4:7 for who maketh thee to differ from another? and what hast thou
that thou didst not receive? now if thou didst receiv it, whi dost
thou glory, as if thou hadst not receiv it?  4:8 now ye are full,
now ye are rich, ye have reign as king without us: and I would to
god ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.

4:9 for I think that god hath set forth us the apostl last, as it
wer appoint to death: for we are made a spectacl unto the world,
and to angels, and to men.

4:10 We are fool for christ' sake, but ye are wise in christ; we are
weak, but ye are strong; ye are honourable, but we are despised.

4:11 even unto thi present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are
naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace; 4:12 and
labour, work with our own hands: be reviled, we bless; being
persecuted, we suffer it: 4:13 be defamed, we intreat: we are made
a the filth of the world, and are the offscour of all thing unto
thi day.

4:14 I write not these thing to shame you, but as my belov son i
warn you.

4:15 for though ye have ten thousand instruct in christ, yet have
y not mani fathers: for in christ jesu I have begotten you through
th gospel.

4:16 wherefor I beseech you, be ye follow of me.

4:17 for thi caus have I sent unto you timotheus, who is my beloved
son, and faith in the lord, who shall bring you into remembr of
mi way which be in christ, as I teach everi where in everi church.

4:18 now some are puf up, as though I would not come to you.

4:19 but I will come to you shortly, if the lord will, and will know,
not the speech of them which are puf up, but the power.

4:20 for the kingdom of god is not in word, but in power.

4:21 what will ye? shall I come unto you with a rod, or in love, and
in the spirit of meekness?  5:1 It is report commonli that there is
forn among you, and such fornic as is not so much as named
among the gentiles, that one should have hi father' wife.

5:2 and ye are puf up, and have not rather mourned, that he that
hath done thi deed might be taken away from among you.

5:3 for I verily, as absent in body, but present in spirit, have
judg already, as though I were present, concern him that hath so
don thi deed, 5:4 In the name of our lord jesu christ, when ye are
gath together, and my spirit, with the power of our lord jesus
christ, 5:5 To deliv such an one unto satan for the destruct of
th flesh, that the spirit may be save in the day of the lord jesus.

5:6 your glori is not good. know ye not that a littl leaven
leaveneth the whole lump?  5:7 purg out therefor the old leaven,
that ye may be a new lump, as ye are unleavened. for even christ our
passov is sacrif for us: 5:8 therefor let us keep the feast,
not with old leaven, neither with the leaven of malic and wickedness;
but with the unleaven bread of sincer and truth.

5:9 I wrote unto you in an epistl not to compani with fornicators:
5:10 yet not altogeth with the fornic of thi world, or with
th covetous, or extortioners, or with idolaters; for then must ye
ne go out of the world.

5:11 but now I have written unto you not to keep company, if ani man
that is call a brother be a fornicator, or covetous, or an idolater,
or a railer, or a drunkard, or an extortioner; with such an one no not
to eat.

5:12 for what have I to do to judg them also that are without? do not
y judg them that are within?  5:13 but them that are without god
judgeth. therefor put away from among yourselv that wick person.

6:1 dare ani of you, have a matter against another, go to law before
th unjust, and not befor the saints?  6:2 Do ye not know that the
saint shall judg the world? and if the world shall be judg by you,
ar ye unworthi to judg the smallest matters?  6:3 know ye not that
w shall judg angels? how much more thing that pertain to thi life?
6:4 If then ye have judgment of thing pertain to thi life, set
them to judg who are least esteem in the church.

6:5 I speak to your shame. Is it so, that there is not a wise man
among you? no, not one that shall be abl to judg between his
brethren?  6:6 but brother goeth to law with brother, and that before
th unbelievers.

6:7 now therefor there is utterli a fault among you, becaus ye go to
law one with another. whi do ye not rather take wrong? whi do ye not
rath suffer yourselv to be defrauded?  6:8 nay, ye do wrong, and
defraud, and that your brethren.

6:9 know ye not that the unright shall not inherit the kingdom of
god?  Be not deceived: neither fornicators, nor idolaters, nor
adulterers, nor effeminate, nor abus of themselv with mankind,
6:10 nor thieves, nor covetous, nor drunkards, nor revilers, nor
extortioners, shall inherit the kingdom of god.

6:11 and such were some of you: but ye are washed, but ye are
sanctified, but ye are justifi in the name of the lord jesus, and by
th spirit of our god.

6:12 all thing are law unto me, but all thing are not expedient:
al thing are law for me, but I will not be brought under the
pow of any.

6:13 meat for the belly, and the belli for meats: but god shall
destroy both it and them. now the bodi is not for fornication, but for
th lord; and the lord for the body.

6:14 and god hath both rais up the lord, and will also rais up us
bi hi own power.

6:15 know ye not that your bodi are the member of christ? shall i
then take the member of christ, and make them the member of an
harlot? god forbid.

6:16 what? know ye not that he which is join to an harlot is one
body?  for two, saith he, shall be one flesh.

6:17 but he that is join unto the lord is one spirit.

6:18 flee fornication. everi sin that a man doeth is without the body;
but he that committeth fornic sinneth against hi own body.

6:19 what? know ye not that your bodi is the templ of the holi ghost
which is in you, which ye have of god, and ye are not your own?  6:20
for ye are bought with a price: therefor glorifi god in your body,
and in your spirit, which are god's.

7:1 now concern the thing whereof ye wrote unto me: It is good for
a man not to touch a woman.

7:2 nevertheless, to avoid fornication, let everi man have hi own
wife, and let everi woman have her own husband.

7:3 let the husband render unto the wife due benevolence: and likewise
also the wife unto the husband.

7:4 the wife hath not power of her own body, but the husband: and
likewis also the husband hath not power of hi own body, but the
wife.

7:5 defraud ye not one the other, except it be with consent for a
time, that ye may give yourselv to fast and prayer; and come
togeth again, that satan tempt you not for your incontinency.

7:6 but I speak thi by permission, and not of commandment.

7:7 for I would that all men were even as I myself. but everi man hath
hi proper gift of god, one after thi manner, and anoth after that.

7:8 I say therefor to the unmarri and widows, It is good for them
if they abid even as i.

7:9 but if they cannot contain, let them marry: for it is better to
marri than to burn.

7:10 and unto the marri I command, yet not I, but the lord, let not
th wife depart from her husband: 7:11 but and if she depart, let her
remain unmarri or be reconcil to her husband: and let not the
husband put away hi wife.

7:12 but to the rest speak I, not the lord: If ani brother hath a wife
that believeth not, and she be pleas to dwell with him, let him not
put her away.

7:13 and the woman which hath an husband that believeth not, and if he
b pleas to dwell with her, let her not leav him.

7:14 for the unbeliev husband is sanctifi by the wife, and the
unbeliev wife is sanctifi by the husband: els were your children
unclean; but now are they holy.

7:15 but if the unbeliev depart, let him depart. A brother or a
sist is not under bondag in such cases: but god hath call us to
peace.

7:16 for what knowest thou, O wife, whether thou shalt save thy
husband?  or how knowest thou, O man, whether thou shalt save thy
wife?  7:17 but as god hath distribut to everi man, as the lord hath
cal everi one, so let him walk. and so ordain I in all churches.

7:18 Is ani man call be circumcised? let him not become
uncircumcised. Is ani call in uncircumcision? let him not be
circumcised.

7:19 circumcis is nothing, and uncircumcis is nothing, but the
keep of the command of god.

7:20 let everi man abid in the same call wherein he wa called.

7:21 art thou call be a servant? care not for it: but if thou
mayest be made free, use it rather.

7:22 for he that is call in the lord, be a servant, is the lord's
freeman: likewis also he that is called, be free, is christ's
servant.

7:23 Ye are bought with a price; be not ye the servant of men.

7:24 brethren, let everi man, wherein he is called, therein abid with
god.

7:25 now concern virgin I have no command of the lord: yet i
giv my judgment, as one that hath obtain merci of the lord to be
faithful.

7:26 I suppos therefor that thi is good for the present distress, i
say, that it is good for a man so to be.

7:27 art thou bound unto a wife? seek not to be loosed. art thou
loos from a wife? seek not a wife.

7:28 but and if thou marry, thou hast not sinned; and if a virgin
marry, she hath not sinned. nevertheless such shall have troubl in
th flesh: but I spare you.

7:29 but thi I say, brethren, the time is short: it remaineth, that
both they that have wive be as though they had none; 7:30 and they
that weep, as though they wept not; and they that rejoice, as though
they rejoic not; and they that buy, as though they possess not;
7:31 and they that use thi world, as not abus it: for the fashion
of thi world passeth away.

7:32 but I would have you without carefulness. He that is unmarried
careth for the thing that belong to the lord, how he may pleas the
lord: 7:33 but he that is marri careth for the thing that are of
th world, how he may pleas hi wife.

7:34 there is differ also between a wife and a virgin. the
unmarri woman careth for the thing of the lord, that she may be
holi both in bodi and in spirit: but she that is marri careth for
th thing of the world, how she may pleas her husband.

7:35 and thi I speak for your own profit; not that I may cast a snare
upon you, but for that which is comely, and that ye may attend upon
th lord without distraction.

7:36 but if ani man think that he behaveth himself uncom toward his
virgin, if she pass the flower of her age, and need so require, let
him do what he will, he sinneth not: let them marry.

7:37 nevertheless he that standeth stedfast in hi heart, have no
necessity, but hath power over hi own will, and hath so decre in
hi heart that he will keep hi virgin, doeth well.

7:38 So then he that giveth her in marriag doeth well; but he that
giveth her not in marriag doeth better.

7:39 the wife is bound by the law as long as her husband liveth; but
if her husband be dead, she is at liberti to be marri to whom she
will; onli in the lord.

7:40 but she is happier if she so abide, after my judgment: and i
think also that I have the spirit of god.

8:1 now as touch thing offer unto idols, we know that we all
hav knowledge. knowledg puffeth up, but chariti edifieth.

8:2 and if ani man think that he knoweth ani thing, he knoweth nothing
yet as he ought to know.

8:3 but if ani man love god, the same is known of him.

8:4 As concern therefor the eat of those thing that are
off in sacrific unto idols, we know that an idol is noth in
th world, and that there is none other god but one.

8:5 for though there be that are call gods, whether in heaven or in
earth, (a there be god many, and lord many,) 8:6 but to us there is
but one god, the father, of whom are all things, and we in him; and
on lord jesu christ, by whom are all things, and we by him.

8:7 howbeit there is not in everi man that knowledge: for some with
consci of the idol unto thi hour eat it as a thing offer unto
an idol; and their conscienc be weak is defiled.

8:8 but meat commendeth us not to god: for neither, if we eat, are we
th better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.

8:9 but take heed lest by ani mean thi liberti of your' becom a
stumblingblock to them that are weak.

8:10 for if ani man see thee which hast knowledg sit at meat in the
idol' temple, shall not the conscienc of him which is weak be
embolden to eat those thing which are offer to idols; 8:11 and
through thi knowledg shall the weak brother perish, for whom christ
died?  8:12 but when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their
weak conscience, ye sin against christ.

8:13 wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh
whil the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.

9:1 Am I not an apostle? am I not free? have I not seen jesu christ
our lord? are not ye my work in the lord?  9:2 If I be not an apostle
unto others, yet doubtless I am to you: for the seal of mine
apostleship are ye in the lord.

9:3 mine answer to them that do examin me is this, 9:4 have we not
pow to eat and to drink?  9:5 have we not power to lead about a
sister, a wife, as well as other apostles, and as the brethren of the
lord, and cephas?  9:6 Or I onli and barnabas, have not we power to
forbear working?  9:7 who goeth a warfar ani time at hi own charges?
who planteth a vineyard, and eateth not of the fruit thereof? or who
feedeth a flock, and eateth not of the milk of the flock?  9:8 say i
thes thing as a man? or saith not the law the same also?  9:9 for it
i written in the law of moses, thou shalt not muzzl the mouth of the
ox that treadeth out the corn. doth god take care for oxen?  9:10 or
saith he it altogeth for our sakes? for our sakes, no doubt, thi is
written: that he that ploweth should plow in hope; and that he that
thresheth in hope should be partak of hi hope.

9:11 If we have sown unto you spiritu things, is it a great thing if
w shall reap your carnal things?  9:12 If other be partak of this
pow over you, are not we rather?  nevertheless we have not use this
power; but suffer all things, lest we should hinder the gospel of
christ.

9:13 Do ye not know that they which minist about holi thing live of
th thing of the temple? and they which wait at the altar are
partak with the altar?  9:14 even so hath the lord ordain that
they which preach the gospel should live of the gospel.

9:15 but I have use none of these things: neither have I written
thes things, that it should be so done unto me: for it were better
for me to die, than that ani man should make my glori void.

9:16 for though I preach the gospel, I have noth to glori of: for
necess is laid upon me; yea, woe is unto me, if I preach not the
gospel!  9:17 for if I do thi thing willingly, I have a reward: but
if against my will, a dispens of the gospel is commit unto me.

9:18 what is my reward then? verili that, when I preach the gospel, i
may make the gospel of christ without charge, that I abus not my
pow in the gospel.

9:19 for though I be free from all men, yet have I made myself servant
unto all, that I might gain the more.

9:20 and unto the jew I becam as a jew, that I might gain the jews;
to them that are under the law, as under the law, that I might gain
them that are under the law; 9:21 To them that are without law, as
without law, (be not without law to god, but under the law to
christ,) that I might gain them that are without law.

9:22 To the weak becam I as weak, that I might gain the weak: I am
mad all thing to all men, that I might by all mean save some.

9:23 and thi I do for the gospel' sake, that I might be partaker
thereof with you.

9:24 know ye not that they which run in a race run all, but one
receiveth the prize? So run, that ye may obtain.

9:25 and everi man that striveth for the masteri is temper in all
things. now they do it to obtain a corrupt crown; but we an
incorruptible.

9:26 I therefor so run, not as uncertainly; so fight I, not as one
that beateth the air: 9:27 but I keep under my body, and bring it into
subjection: lest that by ani means, when I have preach to others, i
myself should be a castaway.

10:1 moreover, brethren, I would not that ye should be ignorant, how
that all our father were under the cloud, and all pass through the
sea; 10:2 and were all baptiz unto mose in the cloud and in the
sea; 10:3 and did all eat the same spiritu meat; 10:4 and did all
drink the same spiritu drink: for they drank of that spiritu rock
that follow them: and that rock wa christ.

10:5 but with mani of them god wa not well pleased: for they were
overthrown in the wilderness.

10:6 now these thing were our examples, to the intent we should not
lust after evil things, as they also lusted.

10:7 neither be ye idolaters, as were some of them; as it is written,
th peopl sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

10:8 neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed, and
fel in one day three and twenti thousand.

10:9 neither let us tempt christ, as some of them also tempted, and
wer destroy of serpents.

10:10 neither murmur ye, as some of them also murmured, and were
destroy of the destroyer.

10:11 now all these thing happen unto them for ensamples: and they
ar written for our admonition, upon whom the end of the world are
come.

10:12 wherefor let him that thinketh he standeth take heed lest he
fall.

10:13 there hath no temptat taken you but such as is common to man:
but god is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempt abov that
y are able; but will with the temptat also make a way to escape,
that ye may be abl to bear it.

10:14 wherefore, my dearli beloved, flee from idolatry.

10:15 I speak as to wise men; judg ye what I say.

10:16 the cup of bless which we bless, is it not the communion of
th blood of christ? the bread which we break, is it not the communion
of the bodi of christ?  10:17 for we be mani are one bread, and one
body: for we are all partak of that one bread.

10:18 behold israel after the flesh: are not they which eat of the
sacrific partak of the altar?  10:19 what say I then? that the
idol is ani thing, or that which is offer in sacrific to idol is
ani thing?  10:20 but I say, that the thing which the gentiles
sacrifice, they sacrific to devils, and not to god: and I would not
that ye should have fellowship with devils.

10:21 Ye cannot drink the cup of the lord, and the cup of devils: ye
cannot be partak of the lord' table, and of the tabl of devils.

10:22 Do we provok the lord to jealousy? are we stronger than he?
10:23 all thing are law for me, but all thing are not expedient:
al thing are law for me, but all thing edifi not.

10:24 let no man seek hi own, but everi man another' wealth.

10:25 whatsoev is sold in the shambles, that eat, ask no question
for conscienc sake: 10:26 for the earth is the lord's, and the
 thereof.

10:27 If ani of them that believ not bid you to a feast, and ye be
dispos to go; whatsoev is set befor you, eat, ask no question
for conscienc sake.

10:28 but if ani man say unto you, thi is offer in sacrific unto
idols, eat not for hi sake that shew it, and for conscienc sake:
for the earth is the lord's, and the ful thereof: 10:29
conscience, I say, not thine own, but of the other: for whi is my
liberti judg of anoth man' conscience?  10:30 for if I by grace
b a partaker, whi am I evil spoken of for that for which I give
thanks?  10:31 whether therefor ye eat, or drink, or whatsoev ye
do, do all to the glori of god.

10:32 give none offence, neither to the jews, nor to the gentiles, nor
to the church of god: 10:33 even as I pleas all men in all things,
not seek mine own profit, but the profit of many, that they may be
saved.

11:1 Be ye follow of me, even as I also am of christ.

11:2 now I prais you, brethren, that ye rememb me in all things,
and keep the ordinances, as I deliv them to you.

11:3 but I would have you know, that the head of everi man is christ;
and the head of the woman is the man; and the head of christ is god.

11:4 everi man pray or prophesying, have hi head covered,
dishonoureth hi head.

11:5 but everi woman that prayeth or prophesieth with her head
uncov dishonoureth her head: for that is even all one as if she
wer shaven.

11:6 for if the woman be not covered, let her also be shorn: but if it
b a shame for a woman to be shorn or shaven, let her be covered.

11:7 for a man inde ought not to cover hi head, forasmuch as he is
th imag and glori of god: but the woman is the glori of the man.

11:8 for the man is not of the woman: but the woman of the man.

11:9 neither wa the man creat for the woman; but the woman for the
man.

11:10 for thi caus ought the woman to have power on her head because
of the angels.

11:11 nevertheless neither is the man without the woman, neither the
woman without the man, in the lord.

11:12 for as the woman is of the man, even so is the man also by the
woman; but all thing of god.

11:13 judg in yourselves: is it come that a woman pray unto god
uncovered?  11:14 doth not even natur itself teach you, that, if a
man have long hair, it is a shame unto him?  11:15 but if a woman have
long hair, it is a glori to her: for her hair is given her for a
covering.

11:16 but if ani man seem to be contentious, we have no such custom,
neith the church of god.

11:17 now in thi that I declar unto you I prais you not, that ye
com togeth not for the better, but for the worse.

11:18 for first of all, when ye come togeth in the church, I hear
that there be divis among you; and I partli believ it.

11:19 for there must be also heresi among you, that they which are
approv may be made manifest among you.

11:20 when ye come togeth therefor into one place, thi is not to
eat the lord' supper.

11:21 for in eat everi one taketh befor other hi own supper: and
on is hungry, and anoth is drunken.

11:22 what? have ye not hous to eat and to drink in? or despis ye
th church of god, and shame them that have not? what shall I say to
you? shall I prais you in this? I prais you not.

11:23 for I have receiv of the lord that which also I deliv unto
you, that the lord jesu the same night in which he wa betray took
bread: 11:24 and when he had given thanks, he brake it, and said,
take, eat: thi is my body, which is broken for you: thi do in
remembr of me.

11:25 after the same manner also he took the cup, when he had supped,
saying, thi cup is the new testament in my blood: thi do ye, as oft
a ye drink it, in remembr of me.

11:26 for as often as ye eat thi bread, and drink thi cup, ye do
shew the lord' death till he come.

11:27 wherefor whosoev shall eat thi bread, and drink thi cup of
th lord, unworthily, shall be guilti of the bodi and blood of the
lord.

11:28 but let a man examin himself, and so let him eat of that bread,
and drink of that cup.

11:29 for he that eateth and drinketh unworthily, eateth and drinketh
damn to himself, not discern the lord' body.

11:30 for thi caus mani are weak and sickli among you, and many
sleep.

11:31 for if we would judg ourselves, we should not be judged.

11:32 but when we are judged, we are chasten of the lord, that we
should not be condemn with the world.

11:33 wherefore, my brethren, when ye come togeth to eat, tarri one
for another.

11:34 and if ani man hunger, let him eat at home; that ye come not
togeth unto condemnation. and the rest will I set in order when i
come.

12:1 now concern spiritu gifts, brethren, I would not have you
ignorant.

12:2 Ye know that ye were gentiles, carri away unto these dumb
idols, even as ye were led.

12:3 wherefor I give you to understand, that no man speak by the
spirit of god calleth jesu accursed: and that no man can say that
jesu is the lord, but by the holi ghost.

12:4 now there are divers of gifts, but the same spirit.

12:5 and there are differ of administrations, but the same lord.

12:6 and there are divers of operations, but it is the same god
which worketh all in all.

12:7 but the manifest of the spirit is given to everi man to
profit withal.

12:8 for to one is given by the spirit the word of wisdom; to another
th word of knowledg by the same spirit; 12:9 To anoth faith by the
sam spirit; to anoth the gift of heal by the same spirit; 12:10
to anoth the work of miracles; to anoth prophecy; to another
discern of spirits; to anoth diver kind of tongues; to another
th interpret of tongues: 12:11 but all these worketh that one
and the selfsam spirit, divid to everi man sever as he will.

12:12 for as the bodi is one, and hath mani members, and all the
memb of that one body, be many, are one body: so also is christ.

12:13 for by one spirit are we all baptiz into one body, whether we
b jew or gentiles, whether we be bond or free; and have been all
mad to drink into one spirit.

12:14 for the bodi is not one member, but many.

12:15 If the foot shall say, becaus I am not the hand, I am not of
th body; is it therefor not of the body?  12:16 and if the ear shall
say, becaus I am not the eye, I am not of the body; is it therefore
not of the body?  12:17 If the whole bodi were an eye, where were the
hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?  12:18
but now hath god set the member everi one of them in the body, as it
hath pleas him.

12:19 and if they were all one member, where were the body?  12:20 but
now are they mani members, yet but one body.

12:21 and the eye cannot say unto the hand, I have no need of thee:
nor again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.

12:22 nay, much more those member of the body, which seem to be more
feeble, are necessary: 12:23 and those member of the body, which we
think to be less honourable, upon these we bestow more abundant
honour; and our uncom part have more abund comeliness.

12:24 for our come part have no need: but god hath temper the
bodi together, have given more abund honour to that part which
lacked.

12:25 that there should be no schism in the body; but that the members
should have the same care one for another.

12:26 and whether one member suffer, all the member suffer with it;
or one member be honoured, all the member rejoic with it.

12:27 now ye are the bodi of christ, and member in particular.

12:28 and god hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondarily
prophets, thirdli teachers, after that miracles, then gift of
healings, helps, governments, divers of tongues.

12:29 are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all
work of miracles?  12:30 have all the gift of healing? do all
speak with tongues? do all interpret?  12:31 but covet earnestli the
best gifts: and yet shew I unto you a more excel way.

13:1 though I speak with the tongu of men and of angels, and have
not charity, I am becom as sound brass, or a tinkl cymbal.

13:2 and though I have the gift of prophecy, and understand all
mysteries, and all knowledge; and though I have all faith, so that i
could remov mountains, and have not charity, I am nothing.

13:3 and though I bestow all my good to feed the poor, and though i
giv my bodi to be burned, and have not charity, it profiteth me
nothing.

13:4 chariti suffereth long, and is kind; chariti envieth not; charity
vaunteth not itself, is not puf up, 13:5 doth not behav itself
unseemly, seeketh not her own, is not easili provoked, thinketh no
evil; 13:6 rejoiceth not in iniquity, but rejoiceth in the truth; 13:7
beareth all things, believeth all things, hopeth all things, endureth
al things.

13:8 chariti never faileth: but whether there be prophecies, they
shal fail; whether there be tongues, they shall cease; whether there
b knowledge, it shall vanish away.

13:9 for we know in part, and we prophesi in part.

13:10 but when that which is perfect is come, then that which is in
part shall be done away.

13:11 when I wa a child, I spake as a child, I understood as a child,
i thought as a child: but when I becam a man, I put away childish
things.

13:12 for now we see through a glass, darkly; but then face to face:
now I know in part; but then shall I know even as also I am known.

13:13 and now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the
greatest of these is charity.

14:1 follow after charity, and desir spiritu gifts, but rather that
y may prophesy.

14:2 for he that speaketh in an unknown tongu speaketh not unto men,
but unto god: for no man understandeth him; howbeit in the spirit he
speaketh mysteries.

14:3 but he that prophesieth speaketh unto men to edification, and
exhortation, and comfort.

14:4 He that speaketh in an unknown tongu edifieth himself; but he
that prophesieth edifieth the church.

14:5 I would that ye all spake with tongu but rather that ye
prophesied: for greater is he that prophesieth than he that speaketh
with tongues, except he interpret, that the church may receive
edifying.

14:6 now, brethren, if I come unto you speak with tongues, what
shal I profit you, except I shall speak to you either by revelation,
or by knowledge, or by prophesying, or by doctrine?  14:7 and even
th without life give sound, whether pipe or harp, except they
giv a distinct in the sounds, how shall it be known what is piped
or harped?  14:8 for if the trumpet give an uncertain sound, who shall
prepar himself to the battle?  14:9 So likewis ye, except ye utter
bi the tongu word easi to be understood, how shall it be known what
i spoken? for ye shall speak into the air.

14:10 there are, it may be, so mani kind of voic in the world, and
non of them is without signification.

14:11 therefor if I know not the mean of the voice, I shall be
unto him that speaketh a barbarian, and he that speaketh shall be a
barbarian unto me.

14:12 even so ye, forasmuch as ye are zealou of spiritu gifts, seek
that ye may excel to the edifi of the church.

14:13 wherefor let him that speaketh in an unknown tongu pray that
h may interpret.

14:14 for if I pray in an unknown tongue, my spirit prayeth, but my
understand is unfruitful.

14:15 what is it then? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray
with the understand also: I will sing with the spirit, and I will
s with the understand also.

14:16 els when thou shalt bless with the spirit, how shall he that
occupieth the room of the unlearn say amen at thi give of thanks,
se he understandeth not what thou sayest?  14:17 for thou verily
givest thank well, but the other is not edified.

14:18 I thank my god, I speak with tongu more than ye all: 14:19 yet
in the church I had rather speak five word with my understanding,
that by my voic I might teach other also, than ten thousand word in
an unknown tongue.

14:20 brethren, be not children in understanding: howbeit in malic be
y children, but in understand be men.

14:21 In the law it is written, with men of other tongu and other
lip will I speak unto thi people; and yet for all that will they not
hear me, saith the lord.

14:22 wherefor tongu are for a sign, not to them that believe, but
to them that believ not: but prophesi serveth not for them that
believ not, but for them which believe.

14:23 If therefor the whole church be come togeth into one place,
and all speak with tongues, and there come in those that are
unlearned, or unbelievers, will they not say that ye are mad?  14:24
but if all prophesy, and there come in one that believeth not, or one
unlearned, he is convinc of all, he is judg of all: 14:25 and thus
ar the secret of hi heart made manifest; and so fall down on his
fac he will worship god, and report that god is in you of a truth.

14:26 how is it then, brethren? when ye come together, everi one of
you hath a psalm, hath a doctrine, hath a tongue, hath a revelation,
hath an interpretation. let all thing be done unto edifying.

14:27 If ani man speak in an unknown tongue, let it be by two, or at
th most by three, and that by course; and let one interpret.

14:28 but if there be no interpreter, let him keep silenc in the
church; and let him speak to himself, and to god.

14:29 let the prophet speak two or three, and let the other judge.

14:30 If ani thing be reveal to anoth that sitteth by, let the
first hold hi peace.

14:31 for ye may all prophesi one by one, that all may learn, and all
may be comforted.

14:32 and the spirit of the prophet are subject to the prophets.

14:33 for god is not the author of confusion, but of peace, as in all
church of the saints.

14:34 let your women keep silenc in the churches: for it is not
permit unto them to speak; but they are command to be under
obedi as also saith the law.

14:35 and if they will learn ani thing, let them ask their husband at
home: for it is a shame for women to speak in the church.

14:36 what? came the word of god out from you? or came it unto you
only?  14:37 If ani man think himself to be a prophet, or spiritual,
let him acknowledg that the thing that I write unto you are the
command of the lord.

14:38 but if ani man be ignorant, let him be ignorant.

14:39 wherefore, brethren, covet to prophesy, and forbid not to speak
with tongues.

14:40 let all thing be done decent and in order.

15:1 moreover, brethren, I declar unto you the gospel which i
preach unto you, which also ye have received, and wherein ye stand;
15:2 By which also ye are saved, if ye keep in memori what I preached
unto you, unless ye have believ in vain.

15:3 for I deliv unto you first of all that which I also received,
how that christ die for our sin accord to the scriptures; 15:4
and that he wa buried, and that he rose again the third day according
to the scriptures: 15:5 and that he wa seen of cephas, then of the
twelve: 15:6 after that, he wa seen of abov five hundr brethren at
once; of whom the greater part remain unto thi present, but some are
fallen asleep.

15:7 after that, he wa seen of james; then of all the apostles.

15:8 and last of all he wa seen of me also, as of one born out of due
time.

15:9 for I am the least of the apostles, that am not meet to be called
an apostle, becaus I persecut the church of god.

15:10 but by the grace of god I am what I am: and hi grace which was
bestow upon me wa not in vain; but I labour more abundantli than
they all: yet not I, but the grace of god which wa with me.

15:11 therefor whether it were I or they, so we preach, and so ye
believed.

15:12 now if christ be preach that he rose from the dead, how say
som among you that there is no resurrect of the dead?  15:13 but
if there be no resurrect of the dead, then is christ not risen:
15:14 and if christ be not risen, then is our preach vain, and your
faith is also vain.

15:15 yea, and we are found fals wit of god; becaus we have
testifi of god that he rais up christ: whom he rais not up, if
so be that the dead rise not.

15:16 for if the dead rise not, then is not christ raised: 15:17 and
if christ be not raised, your faith is vain; ye are yet in your sins.

15:18 then they also which are fallen asleep in christ are perished.

15:19 If in thi life onli we have hope in christ, we are of all men
most miserable.

15:20 but now is christ risen from the dead, and becom the
firstfruit of them that slept.

15:21 for sinc by man came death, by man came also the resurrection
of the dead.

15:22 for as in adam all die, even so in christ shall all be made
alive.

15:23 but everi man in hi own order: christ the firstfruits;
afterward they that are christ' at hi coming.

15:24 then cometh the end, when he shall have deliv up the kingdom
to god, even the father; when he shall have put down all rule and all
author and power.

15:25 for he must reign, till he hath put all enemi under hi feet.

15:26 the last enemi that shall be destroy is death.

15:27 for he hath put all thing under hi feet. but when he saith all
th are put under him, it is manifest that he is excepted, which
did put all thing under him.

15:28 and when all thing shall be subdu unto him, then shall the
son also himself be subject unto him that put all thing under him,
that god may be all in all.

15:29 els what shall they do which are baptiz for the dead, if the
dead rise not at all? whi are they then baptiz for the dead?  15:30
and whi stand we in jeopardi everi hour?  15:31 I protest by your
rejo which I have in christ jesu our lord, I die daily.

15:32 If after the manner of men I have fought with beast at ephesus,
what advantageth it me, if the dead rise not? let us eat and drink;
for to morrow we die.

15:33 Be not deceived: evil commun corrupt good manners.

15:34 awak to righteousness, and sin not; for some have not the
knowledg of god: I speak thi to your shame.

15:35 but some man will say, how are the dead rais up? and with what
bodi do they come?  15:36 thou fool, that which thou sowest is not
quickened, except it die: 15:37 and that which thou sowest, thou
sowest not that bodi that shall be, but bare grain, it may chanc of
wheat, or of some other grain: 15:38 but god giveth it a bodi as it
hath pleas him, and to everi seed hi own body.

15:39 all flesh is not the same flesh: but there is one kind of flesh
of men, anoth flesh of beasts, anoth of fishes, and anoth of
birds.

15:40 there are also celesti bodies, and bodi terrestrial: but the
glori of the celesti is one, and the glori of the terrestri is
another.

15:41 there is one glori of the sun, and anoth glori of the moon,
and anoth glori of the stars: for one star differeth from another
star in glory.

15:42 So also is the resurrect of the dead. It is sown in
corruption; it is rais in incorruption: 15:43 It is sown in
dishonour; it is rais in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised
in power: 15:44 It is sown a natur body; it is rais a spiritual
body. there is a natur body, and there is a spiritu body.

15:45 and so it is written, the first man adam wa made a live soul;
th last adam wa made a quicken spirit.

15:46 howbeit that wa not first which is spiritual, but that which is
natural; and afterward that which is spiritual.

15:47 the first man is of the earth, earthy; the second man is the
lord from heaven.

15:48 As is the earthy, such are they also that are earthy: and as is
th heavenly, such are they also that are heavenly.

15:49 and as we have born the imag of the earthy, we shall also bear
th imag of the heavenly.

15:50 now thi I say, brethren, that flesh and blood cannot inherit
th kingdom of god; neither doth corrupt inherit incorruption.

15:51 behold, I shew you a mystery; We shall not all sleep, but we
shal all be changed, 15:52 In a moment, in the twinkl of an eye,
at the last trump: for the trumpet shall sound, and the dead shall be
rais incorruptible, and we shall be changed.

15:53 for thi corrupt must put on incorruption, and thi mortal
must put on immortality.

15:54 So when thi corrupt shall have put on incorruption, and
thi mortal shall have put on immortality, then shall be brought to
pass the say that is written, death is swallow up in victory.

15:55 O death, where is thi sting? O grave, where is thi victory?
15:56 the sting of death is sin; and the strength of sin is the law.

15:57 but thank be to god, which giveth us the victori through our
lord jesu christ.

15:58 therefore, my belov brethren, be ye stedfast, unmoveable,
alway abound in the work of the lord, forasmuch as ye know that
your labour is not in vain in the lord.

16:1 now concern the collect for the saints, as I have given
ord to the church of galatia, even so do ye.

16:2 upon the first day of the week let everi one of you lay by him in
store, as god hath prosper him, that there be no gather when i
come.

16:3 and when I come, whomsoev ye shall approv by your letters,
them will I send to bring your liber unto jerusalem.

16:4 and if it be meet that I go also, they shall go with me.

16:5 now I will come unto you, when I shall pass through macedonia:
for I do pass through macedonia.

16:6 and it may be that I will abide, yea, and winter with you, that
y may bring me on my journey whithersoev I go.

16:7 for I will not see you now by the way; but I trust to tarri a
whil with you, if the lord permit.

16:8 but I will tarri at ephesu until pentecost.

16:9 for a great door and effectu is open unto me, and there are
mani adversaries.

16:10 now if timotheu come, see that he may be with you without fear:
for he worketh the work of the lord, as I also do.

16:11 let no man therefor despis him: but conduct him forth in
peace, that he may come unto me: for I look for him with the brethren.

16:12 As touch our brother apollos, I greatli desir him to come
unto you with the brethren: but hi will wa not at all to come at
thi time; but he will come when he shall have conveni time.

16:13 watch ye, stand fast in the faith, quit you like men, be strong.

16:14 let all your thing be done with charity.

16:15 I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the hous of stephanas, that
it is the firstfruit of achaia, and that they have addicted
themselv to the ministri of the saints,) 16:16 that ye submit
yourselv unto such, and to everi one that helpeth with us, and
laboureth.

16:17 I am glad of the come of stephana and fortunatu and
achaicus: for that which wa lack on your part they have supplied.

16:18 for they have refresh my spirit and your's: therefore
acknowledg ye them that are such.

16:19 the church of asia salut you. aquila and priscilla salut you
much in the lord, with the church that is in their house.

16:20 all the brethren greet you. greet ye one anoth with
an holi kiss.

16:21 the salut of me paul with mine own hand.

16:22 If ani man love not the lord jesu christ, let him be
anathema maranatha.

16:23 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you.

16:24 My love be with you all in christ jesus. amen.




th second epistl of paul the apostl to the corinthians


1:1 paul, an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god, and timothy
our brother, unto the church of god which is at corinth, with all the
saint which are in all achaia: 1:2 grace be to you and peac from god
our father, and from the lord jesu christ.

1:3 bless be god, even the father of our lord jesu christ, the
fath of mercies, and the god of all comfort; 1:4 who comforteth us
in all our tribulation, that we may be abl to comfort them which are
in ani trouble, by the comfort wherewith we ourselv are comfort of
god.

1:5 for as the suffer of christ abound in us, so our consolation
also aboundeth by christ.

1:6 and whether we be afflicted, it is for your consol and
salvation, which is effectu in the endur of the same sufferings
which we also suffer: or whether we be comforted, it is for your
consol and salvation.

1:7 and our hope of you is stedfast, knowing, that as ye are partakers
of the sufferings, so shall ye be also of the consolation.

1:8 for we would not, brethren, have you ignor of our troubl which
cam to us in asia, that we were press out of measure, above
strength, insomuch that we despair even of life: 1:9 but we had the
sent of death in ourselves, that we should not trust in ourselves,
but in god which raiseth the dead: 1:10 who deliv us from so great
a death, and doth deliver: in whom we trust that he will yet deliver
us; 1:11 Ye also help togeth by prayer for us, that for the gift
bestow upon us by the mean of mani person thank may be given by
mani on our behalf.

1:12 for our rejoic is this, the testimoni of our conscience, that
in simplic and godli sincerity, not with fleshli wisdom, but by the
grac of god, we have had our convers in the world, and more
abundantli to you-ward.

1:13 for we write none other thing unto you, than what ye read or
acknowledge; and I trust ye shall acknowledg even to the end; 1:14 as
also ye have acknowledg us in part, that we are your rejoicing, even
a ye also are our' in the day of the lord jesus.

1:15 and in thi confid I wa mind to come unto you before, that
y might have a second benefit; 1:16 and to pass by you into
macedonia, and to come again out of macedonia unto you, and of you to
b brought on my way toward judaea.

1:17 when I therefor wa thu minded, did I use lightness? or the
th that I purpose, do I purpos accord to the flesh, that with
m there should be yea yea, and nay nay?  1:18 but as god is true, our
word toward you wa not yea and nay.

1:19 for the son of god, jesu christ, who wa preach among you by
us, even by me and silvanu and timotheus, wa not yea and nay, but in
him wa yea.

1:20 for all the promis of god in him are yea, and in him amen, unto
th glori of god by us.

1:21 now he which stablisheth us with you in christ, and hath anointed
us, is god; 1:22 who hath also seal us, and given the earnest of the
spirit in our hearts.

1:23 moreov I call god for a record upon my soul, that to spare you
i came not as yet unto corinth.

1:24 not for that we have dominion over your faith, but are helper of
your joy: for by faith ye stand.

2:1 but I determin thi with myself, that I would not come again to
you in heaviness.

2:2 for if I make you sorry, who is he then that maketh me glad, but
th same which is made sorri by me?  2:3 and I wrote thi same unto
you, lest, when I came, I should have sorrow from them of whom I ought
to rejoice; have confid in you all, that my joy is the joy of
you all.

2:4 for out of much afflict and anguish of heart I wrote unto you
with mani tears; not that ye should be grieved, but that ye might know
th love which I have more abundantli unto you.

2:5 but if ani have caus grief, he hath not griev me, but in part:
that I may not overcharg you all.

2:6 suffici to such a man is thi punishment, which wa inflicted
of many.

2:7 So that contrariwis ye ought rather to forgiv him, and comfort
him, lest perhap such a one should be swallow up with overmuch
sorrow.

2:8 wherefor I beseech you that ye would confirm your love toward
him.

2:9 for to thi end also did I write, that I might know the proof of
you, whether ye be obedi in all things.

2:10 To whom ye forgiv ani thing, I forgiv also: for if I forgave
ani thing, to whom I forgav it, for your sake forgav I it in the
person of christ; 2:11 lest satan should get an advantag of us: for
w are not ignor of hi devices.

2:12 furthermore, when I came to troa to preach christ' gospel, and
a door wa open unto me of the lord, 2:13 I had no rest in my
spirit, becaus I found not titu my brother: but take my leav of
them, I went from thenc into macedonia.

2:14 now thank be unto god, which alway causeth us to triumph in
christ, and maketh manifest the savour of hi knowledg by us in every
place.

2:15 for we are unto god a sweet savour of christ, in them that are
saved, and in them that perish: 2:16 To the one we are the savour of
death unto death; and to the other the savour of life unto life. and
who is suffici for these things?  2:17 for we are not as many,
which corrupt the word of god: but as of sincerity, but as of god, in
th sight of god speak we in christ.

3:1 Do we begin again to commend ourselves? or need we, as some
others, epistl of commend to you, or letter of commendation
from you?  3:2 Ye are our epistl written in our hearts, known and
read of all men: 3:3 forasmuch as ye are manifestli declar to be the
epistl of christ minist by us, written not with ink, but with the
spirit of the live god; not in tabl of stone, but in fleshi tables
of the heart.

3:4 and such trust have we through christ to god-ward: 3:5 not that we
ar suffici of ourselv to think ani thing as of ourselves; but
our suffici is of god; 3:6 who also hath made us abl minist of
th new testament; not of the letter, but of the spirit: for the
lett killeth, but the spirit giveth life.

3:7 but if the ministr of death, written and engraven in stones,
wa glorious, so that the children of israel could not stedfastly
behold the face of mose for the glori of hi countenance; which glory
wa to be done away: 3:8 how shall not the ministr of the spirit
b rather glorious?  3:9 for if the ministr of condemn be
glory, much more doth the ministr of righteous exceed in
glory.

3:10 for even that which wa made gloriou had no glori in this
respect, by reason of the glori that excelleth.

3:11 for if that which is done away wa glorious, much more that which
remaineth is glorious.

3:12 see then that we have such hope, we use great plain of
speech: 3:13 and not as moses, which put a vail over hi face, that
th children of israel could not stedfastli look to the end of that
which is abolished: 3:14 but their mind were blinded: for until this
day remaineth the same vail untaken away in the read of the old
testament; which vail is done away in christ.

3:15 but even unto thi day, when mose is read, the vail is upon
their heart.

3:16 nevertheless when it shall turn to the lord, the vail shall be
taken away.

3:17 now the lord is that spirit: and where the spirit of the lord is,
ther is liberty.

3:18 but we all, with open face behold as in a glass the glori of
th lord, are chang into the same imag from glori to glory, even as
bi the spirit of the lord.

4:1 therefor see we have thi ministry, as we have receiv mercy,
w faint not; 4:2 but have renounc the hidden thing of dishonesty,
not walk in craftiness, nor handl the word of god deceitfully;
but by manifest of the truth commend ourselv to everi man's
consci in the sight of god.

4:3 but if our gospel be hid, it is hid to them that are lost: 4:4 in
whom the god of thi world hath blind the mind of them which
believ not, lest the light of the gloriou gospel of christ, who is
th imag of god, should shine unto them.

4:5 for we preach not ourselves, but christ jesu the lord; and
ourselv your servant for jesus' sake.

4:6 for god, who command the light to shine out of darkness, hath
shin in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledg of the glory
of god in the face of jesu christ.

4:7 but we have thi treasur in earthen vessels, that the excellency
of the power may be of god, and not of us.

4:8 We are troubl on everi side, yet not distressed; we are
perplexed, but not in despair; 4:9 persecuted, but not forsaken; cast
down, but not destroyed; 4:10 alway bear about in the bodi the
di of the lord jesus, that the life also of jesu might be made
manifest in our body.

4:11 for we which live are alway deliv unto death for jesus' sake,
that the life also of jesu might be made manifest in our mortal
flesh.

4:12 So then death worketh in us, but life in you.

4:13 We have the same spirit of faith, accord as it is written, i
believed, and therefor have I spoken; we also believe, and therefore
speak; 4:14 know that he which rais up the lord jesu shall raise
up us also by jesus, and shall present us with you.

4:15 for all thing are for your sakes, that the abund grace might
through the thanksgiv of mani redound to the glori of god.

4:16 for which caus we faint not; but though our outward man perish,
yet the inward man is renew day by day.

4:17 for our light affliction, which is but for a moment, worketh for
u a far more exceed and etern weight of glory; 4:18 while we
look not at the thing which are seen, but at the thing which are not
seen: for the thing which are seen are temporal; but the thing which
ar not seen are eternal.

5:1 for we know that if our earthli hous of thi tabernacl were
dissolved, we have a build of god, an hous not made with hands,
etern in the heavens.

5:2 for in thi we groan, earnestli desir to be cloth upon with
our hous which is from heaven: 5:3 If so be that be cloth we
shal not be found naked.

5:4 for we that are in thi tabernacl do groan, be burdened: not
for that we would be unclothed, but cloth upon, that mortal might
b swallow up of life.

5:5 now he that hath wrought us for the selfsam thing is god, who
also hath given unto us the earnest of the spirit.

5:6 therefor we are alway confident, know that, whilst we are at
hom in the body, we are absent from the lord: 5:7 (for we walk by
faith, not by sight:) 5:8 We are confident, I say, and will rather
to be absent from the body, and to be present with the lord.

5:9 wherefor we labour, that, whether present or absent, we may be
accept of him.

5:10 for we must all appear befor the judgment seat of christ; that
everi one may receiv the thing done in hi body, accord to that
h hath done, whether it be good or bad.

5:11 know therefor the terror of the lord, we persuad men; but we
ar made manifest unto god; and I trust also are made manifest in your
consciences.

5:12 for we commend not ourselv again unto you, but give you
occas to glori on our behalf, that ye may have somewhat to answer
them which glori in appearance, and not in heart.

5:13 for whether we be besid ourselves, it is to god: or whether we
b sober, it is for your cause.

5:14 for the love of christ constraineth us; becaus we thu judge,
that if one die for all, then were all dead: 5:15 and that he died
for all, that they which live should not henceforth live unto
themselves, but unto him which die for them, and rose again.

5:16 wherefor henceforth know we no man after the flesh: yea, though
w have known christ after the flesh, yet now henceforth know we him
no more.

5:17 therefor if ani man be in christ, he is a new creature: old
th are pass away; behold, all thing are becom new.

5:18 and all thing are of god, who hath reconcil us to himself by
jesu christ, and hath given to us the ministri of reconciliation;
5:19 To wit, that god wa in christ, reconcil the world unto
himself, not imput their trespass unto them; and hath committed
unto us the word of reconciliation.

5:20 now then we are ambassador for christ, as though god did beseech
y by us: we pray you in christ' stead, be ye reconcil to god.

5:21 for he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin; that we
might be made the righteous of god in him.

6:1 We then, as worker togeth with him, beseech you also that ye
rec not the grace of god in vain.

6:2 (for he saith, I have heard thee in a time accepted, and in the
day of salvat have I succour thee: behold, now is the accepted
time; behold, now is the day of salvation.)  6:3 give no offenc in
ani thing, that the ministri be not blamed: 6:4 but in all things
approv ourselv as the minist of god, in much patience, in
afflictions, in necessities, in distresses, 6:5 In stripes, in
imprisonments, in tumults, in labours, in watchings, in fastings; 6:6
bi pureness, by knowledge, by longsuffering, by kindness, by the holy
ghost, by love unfeigned, 6:7 By the word of truth, by the power of
god, by the armour of righteous on the right hand and on the left,
6:8 By honour and dishonour, by evil report and good report: as
deceivers, and yet true; 6:9 As unknown, and yet well known; as dying,
and, behold, we live; as chastened, and not killed; 6:10 As sorrowful,
yet alway rejoicing; as poor, yet make mani rich; as have nothing,
and yet possess all things.

6:11 O ye corinthians, our mouth is open unto you, our heart is
enlarged.

6:12 Ye are not straiten in us, but ye are straiten in your own
bowels.

6:13 now for a recomp in the same, (I speak as unto my children,)
b ye also enlarged.

6:14 Be ye not unequ yoke togeth with unbelievers: for what
fellowship hath righteous with unrighteousness? and what communion
hath light with darkness?  6:15 and what concord hath christ with
belial? or what part hath he that believeth with an infidel?  6:16 and
what agreement hath the templ of god with idols? for ye are the
templ of the live god; as god hath said, I will dwell in them, and
walk in them; and I will be their god, and they shall be my people.

6:17 wherefor come out from among them, and be ye separate, saith the
