lord, and touch not the unclean thing; and I will receiv you.

6:18 and will be a father unto you, and ye shall be my son and
daughters, saith the lord almighty.

7:1 have therefor these promises, dearli beloved, let us cleanse
ourselv from all filthi of the flesh and spirit, perfecting
holi in the fear of god.

7:2 receiv us; we have wrong no man, we have corrupt no man, we
hav defraud no man.

7:3 I speak not thi to condemn you: for I have said before, that ye
ar in our heart to die and live with you.

7:4 great is my bold of speech toward you, great is my glori of
you: I am fill with comfort, I am exceed joy in all our
tribulation.

7:5 for, when we were come into macedonia, our flesh had no rest, but
w were troubl on everi side; without were fightings, within were
fears.

7:6 nevertheless god, that comforteth those that are cast down,
comfort us by the come of titus; 7:7 and not by hi come only,
but by the consol wherewith he wa comfort in you, when he told
u your earnest desire, your mourning, your fervent mind toward me; so
that I rejoic the more.

7:8 for though I made you sorri with a letter, I do not repent, though
i did repent: for I perceiv that the same epistl hath made you
sorry, though it were but for a season.

7:9 now I rejoice, not that ye were made sorry, but that ye sorrowed
to repentance: for ye were made sorri after a godli manner, that ye
might receiv damag by us in nothing.

7:10 for godli sorrow worketh repent to salvat not to be
rep of: but the sorrow of the world worketh death.

7:11 for behold thi selfsam thing, that ye sorrow after a godly
sort, what care it wrought in you, yea, what clear of
yourselves, yea, what indignation, yea, what fear, yea, what vehement
desire, yea, what zeal, yea, what revenge! In all thing ye have
approv yourselv to be clear in thi matter.

7:12 wherefore, though I wrote unto you, I did it not for hi cause
that had done the wrong, nor for hi caus that suffer wrong, but
that our care for you in the sight of god might appear unto you.

7:13 therefor we were comfort in your comfort: yea, and exceedingly
th more joy we for the joy of titus, becaus hi spirit was
refresh by you all.

7:14 for if I have boast ani thing to him of you, I am not ashamed;
but as we spake all thing to you in truth, even so our boasting,
which I made befor titus, is found a truth.

7:15 and hi inward affect is more abund toward you, whilst he
remembereth the obedi of you all, how with fear and trembl ye
receiv him.

7:16 I rejoic therefor that I have confid in you in all things.

8:1 moreover, brethren, we do you to wit of the grace of god bestowed
on the church of macedonia; 8:2 how that in a great trial of
afflict the abund of their joy and their deep poverti abounded
unto the rich of their liberality.

8:3 for to their power, I bear record, yea, and beyond their power
they were will of themselves; 8:4 pray us with much intreaty
that we would receiv the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the
minist to the saints.

8:5 and thi they did, not as we hoped, but first gave their own
selv to the lord, and unto us by the will of god.

8:6 insomuch that we desir titus, that as he had begun, so he would
also finish in you the same grace also.

8:7 therefore, as ye abound in everi thing, in faith, and utterance,
and knowledge, and in all diligence, and in your love to us, see that
y abound in thi grace also.

8:8 I speak not by commandment, but by occas of the forward of
others, and to prove the sincer of your love.

8:9 for ye know the grace of our lord jesu christ, that, though he
wa rich, yet for your sake he becam poor, that ye through his
poverti might be rich.

8:10 and herein I give my advice: for thi is expedi for you, who
hav begun before, not onli to do, but also to be forward a year ago.

8:11 now therefor perform the do of it; that as there wa a
readi to will, so there may be a perform also out of that
which ye have.

8:12 for if there be first a will mind, it is accept accord to
that a man hath, and not accord to that he hath not.

8:13 for I mean not that other men be eased, and ye burdened: 8:14 but
bi an equality, that now at thi time your abund may be a supply
for their want, that their abund also may be a suppli for your
want: that there may be equality: 8:15 As it is written, He that had
gath much had noth over; and he that had gather littl had no
lack.

8:16 but thank be to god, which put the same earnest care into the
heart of titu for you.

8:17 for inde he accept the exhortation; but be more forward,
of hi own accord he went unto you.

8:18 and we have sent with him the brother, whose prais is in the
gospel throughout all the churches; 8:19 and not that only, but who
wa also chosen of the church to travel with us with thi grace,
which is administ by us to the glori of the same lord, and
declar of your readi mind: 8:20 avoid this, that no man should
blam us in thi abund which is administ by us: 8:21 providing
for honest things, not onli in the sight of the lord, but also in the
sight of men.

8:22 and we have sent with them our brother, whom we have oftentimes
prov dilig in mani things, but now much more diligent, upon the
great confid which I have in you.

8:23 whether ani do enquir of titus, he is my partner and
fellowhelp concern you: or our brethren be enquir of, they are
th messeng of the churches, and the glori of christ.

8:24 wherefor shew ye to them, and befor the churches, the proof of
your love, and of our boast on your behalf.

9:1 for as touch the minist to the saints, it is superfluous
for me to write to you: 9:2 for I know the forward of your mind,
for which I boast of you to them of macedonia, that achaia wa readi a
year ago; and your zeal hath provok veri many.

9:3 yet have I sent the brethren, lest our boast of you should be
in vain in thi behalf; that, as I said, ye may be ready: 9:4 lest
hapli if they of macedonia come with me, and find you unprepared, we
(that we say not, ye) should be asham in thi same confident
boasting.

9:5 therefor I thought it necessari to exhort the brethren, that they
would go befor unto you, and make up beforehand your bounty, whereof
y had notic before, that the same might be ready, as a matter of
bounty, and not as of covetousness.

9:6 but thi I say, He which soweth sparingli shall reap also
sparingly; and he which soweth bounti shall reap also
bountifully.

9:7 everi man accord as he purposeth in hi heart, so let him give;
not grudgingly, or of necessity: for god loveth a cheer giver.

9:8 and god is abl to make all grace abound toward you; that ye,
alway have all suffici in all things, may abound to everi good
work: 9:9 (a it is written, He hath dispers abroad; he hath given
to the poor: hi righteous remaineth for ever.

9:10 now he that ministereth seed to the sower both minist bread for
your food, and multipli your seed sown, and increas the fruit of
your righteousness;) 9:11 be enrich in everi thing to all
bountifulness, which causeth through us thanksgiv to god.

9:12 for the administr of thi servic not onli supplieth the
want of the saints, but is abund also by mani thanksgiv unto
god; 9:13 while by the experi of thi ministr they glorify
god for your profess subject unto the gospel of christ, and for
your liber distribut unto them, and unto all men; 9:14 and by
their prayer for you, which long after you for the exceed grace of
god in you.

9:15 thank be unto god for hi unspeak gift.

10:1 now I paul myself beseech you by the meek and gentl of
christ, who in presenc am base among you, but be absent am bold
toward you: 10:2 but I beseech you, that I may not be bold when I am
pres with that confidence, wherewith I think to be bold against
some, which think of us as if we walk accord to the flesh.

10:3 for though we walk in the flesh, we do not war after the flesh:
10:4 (for the weapon of our warfar are not carnal, but mighty
through god to the pull down of strong holds;) 10:5 cast down
imaginations, and everi high thing that exalteth itself against the
knowledg of god, and bring into captiv everi thought to the
obedi of christ; 10:6 and have in a readi to reveng all
disobedience, when your obedi is fulfilled.

10:7 Do ye look on thing after the outward appearance? If ani man
trust to himself that he is christ's, let him of himself think this
again, that, as he is christ's, even so are we christ's.

10:8 for though I should boast somewhat more of our authority, which
th lord hath given us for edification, and not for your destruction,
i should not be ashamed: 10:9 that I may not seem as if I would
terrifi you by letters.

10:10 for hi letters, say they, are weighti and powerful; but his
bodili presenc is weak, and hi speech contemptible.

10:11 let such an one think this, that, such as we are in word by
lett when we are absent, such will we be also in deed when we are
present.

10:12 for we dare not make ourselv of the number, or compare
ourselv with some that commend themselves: but they measuring
themselv by themselves, and compar themselv among themselves,
ar not wise.

10:13 but we will not boast of thing without our measure, but
accord to the measur of the rule which god hath distribut to us,
a measur to reach even unto you.

10:14 for we stretch not ourselv beyond our measure, as though we
reach not unto you: for we are come as far as to you also in
preach the gospel of christ: 10:15 not boast of thing without
our measure, that is, of other men' labours; but have hope, when
your faith is increased, that we shall be enlarg by you accord to
our rule abundantly, 10:16 To preach the gospel in the region beyond
you, and not to boast in anoth man' line of thing made readi to
our hand.

10:17 but he that glorieth, let him glori in the lord.

10:18 for not he that commendeth himself is approved, but whom the
lord commendeth.

11:1 would to god ye could bear with me a littl in my folly: and
inde bear with me.

11:2 for I am jealou over you with godli jealousy: for I have
esp you to one husband, that I may present you as a chast virgin
to christ.

11:3 but I fear, lest by ani means, as the serpent beguil eve
through hi subtilty, so your mind should be corrupt from the
simpl that is in christ.

11:4 for if he that cometh preacheth anoth jesus, whom we have not
preached, or if ye receiv anoth spirit, which ye have not received,
or anoth gospel, which ye have not accepted, ye might well bear with
him.

11:5 for I suppos I wa not a whit behind the veri chiefest apostles.

11:6 but though I be rude in speech, yet not in knowledge; but we have
been throughli made manifest among you in all things.

11:7 have I commit an offenc in abas myself that ye might be
exalted, becaus I have preach to you the gospel of god freely?
11:8 I rob other churches, take wage of them, to do you service.

11:9 and when I wa present with you, and wanted, I wa chargeabl to
no man: for that which wa lack to me the brethren which came from
macedonia supplied: and in all thing I have kept myself from being
burdensom unto you, and so will I keep myself.

11:10 As the truth of christ is in me, no man shall stop me of this
boast in the region of achaia.

11:11 wherefore? becaus I love you not? god knoweth.

11:12 but what I do, that I will do, that I may cut off occas from
them which desir occasion; that wherein they glory, they may be found
even as we.

11:13 for such are fals apostles, deceit workers, transforming
themselv into the apostl of christ.

11:14 and no marvel; for satan himself is transform into an angel of
light.

11:15 therefor it is no great thing if hi minist also be
transform as the minist of righteousness; whose end shall be
accord to their works.

11:16 I say again, let no man think me a fool; if otherwise, yet as a
fool receiv me, that I may boast myself a little.

11:17 that which I speak, I speak it not after the lord, but as it
wer foolishly, in thi confid of boasting.

11:18 see that mani glori after the flesh, I will glori also.

11:19 for ye suffer fool gladly, see ye yourselv are wise.

11:20 for ye suffer, if a man bring you into bondage, if a man devour
you, if a man take of you, if a man exalt himself, if a man smite you
on the face.

11:21 I speak as concern reproach, as though we had been weak.
howbeit whereinsoev ani is bold, (I speak foolishly,) I am bold
also.

11:22 are they hebrews? so am I. are they israelites? so am I. are
they the seed of abraham? so am i.

11:23 are they minist of christ? (I speak as a fool) I am more; in
labour more abundant, in stripe abov measure, in prison more
frequent, in death oft.

11:24 Of the jew five time receiv I forti stripe save one.

11:25 thrice wa I beaten with rods, onc wa I stoned, thrice i
suff shipwreck, a night and a day I have been in the deep; 11:26
in journey often, in peril of waters, in peril of robbers, in
peril by mine own countrymen, in peril by the heathen, in peril in
th city, in peril in the wilderness, in peril in the sea, in perils
among fals brethren; 11:27 In weari and painfulness, in watchings
often, in hunger and thirst, in fast often, in cold and nakedness.

11:28 besid those thing that are without, that which cometh upon me
daily, the care of all the churches.

11:29 who is weak, and I am not weak? who is offended, and I burn not?
11:30 If I must need glory, I will glori of the thing which concern
min infirmities.

11:31 the god and father of our lord jesu christ, which is blessed
for evermore, knoweth that I lie not.

11:32 In damascu the governor under areta the king kept the citi of
th damascen with a garrison, desir to apprehend me: 11:33 and
through a window in a basket wa I let down by the wall, and escaped
hi hands.

12:1 It is not expedi for me doubtless to glory. I will come to
vis and revel of the lord.

12:2 I knew a man in christ abov fourteen year ago, (whether in the
body, I cannot tell; or whether out of the body, I cannot tell: god
knoweth;) such an one caught up to the third heaven.

12:3 and I knew such a man, (whether in the body, or out of the body,
i cannot tell: god knoweth;) 12:4 how that he wa caught up into
paradise, and heard unspeak words, which it is not law for a
man to utter.

12:5 Of such an one will I glory: yet of myself I will not glory, but
in mine infirmities.

12:6 for though I would desir to glory, I shall not be a fool; for i
wil say the truth: but now I forbear, lest ani man should think of me
abov that which he seeth me to be, or that he heareth of me.

12:7 and lest I should be exalt abov measur through the abundance
of the revelations, there wa given to me a thorn in the flesh, the
messeng of satan to buffet me, lest I should be exalt above
measure.

12:8 for thi thing I besought the lord thrice, that it might depart
from me.

12:9 and he said unto me, My grace is suffici for thee: for my
strength is made perfect in weakness. most gladli therefor will i
rath glori in my infirmities, that the power of christ may rest upon
me.

12:10 therefor I take pleasur in infirmities, in reproaches, in
necessities, in persecutions, in distress for christ' sake: for
when I am weak, then am I strong.

12:11 I am becom a fool in glorying; ye have compel me: for i
ought to have been commend of you: for in noth am I behind the
veri chiefest apostles, though I be nothing.

12:12 truli the sign of an apostl were wrought among you in all
patience, in signs, and wonders, and mighti deeds.

12:13 for what is it wherein ye were inferior to other churches,
except it be that I myself wa not burdensom to you? forgiv me this
wrong.

12:14 behold, the third time I am readi to come to you; and I will not
b burdensom to you: for I seek not your' but you: for the children
ought not to lay up for the parents, but the parent for the children.

12:15 and I will veri gladli spend and be spent for you; though the
mor abundantli I love you, the less I be loved.

12:16 but be it so, I did not burden you: nevertheless, be crafty,
i caught you with guile.

12:17 did I make a gain of you by ani of them whom I sent unto you?
12:18 I desir titus, and with him I sent a brother. did titu make a
gain of you? walk we not in the same spirit? walk we not in the
sam steps?  12:19 again, think ye that we excus ourselv unto you?
w speak befor god in christ: but we do all things, dearli beloved,
for your edifying.

12:20 for I fear, lest, when I come, I shall not find you such as i
would, and that I shall be found unto you such as ye would not: lest
ther be debates, envyings, wraths, strifes, backbitings, whisperings,
swellings, tumults: 12:21 and lest, when I come again, my god will
humbl me among you, and that I shall bewail mani which have sinned
already, and have not repent of the unclean and fornic and
lascivi which they have committed.

13:1 thi is the third time I am come to you. In the mouth of two or
thre wit shall everi word be established.

13:2 I told you before, and foretel you, as if I were present, the
second time; and be absent now I write to them which heretofore
hav sinned, and to all other, that, if I come again, I will not
spare: 13:3 sinc ye seek a proof of christ speak in me, which to
you-ward is not weak, but is mighti in you.

13:4 for though he wa crucifi through weakness, yet he liveth by
th power of god. for we also are weak in him, but we shall live with
him by the power of god toward you.

13:5 examin yourselves, whether ye be in the faith; prove your own
selves. know ye not your own selves, how that jesu christ is in you,
except ye be reprobates?  13:6 but I trust that ye shall know that we
ar not reprobates.

13:7 now I pray to god that ye do no evil; not that we should appear
approved, but that ye should do that which is honest, though we be as
reprobates.

13:8 for we can do noth against the truth, but for the truth.

13:9 for we are glad, when we are weak, and ye are strong: and this
also we wish, even your perfection.

13:10 therefor I write these thing be absent, lest be present
i should use sharpness, accord to the power which the lord hath
given me to edification, and not to destruction.

13:11 finally, brethren, farewell. Be perfect, be of good comfort, be
of one mind, live in peace; and the god of love and peac shall be
with you.

13:12 greet one anoth with an holi kiss.

13:13 all the saint salut you.

13:14 the grace of the lord jesu christ, and the love of god, and the
communion of the holi ghost, be with you all. amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the galatians


1:1 paul, an apostle, (not of men, neither by man, but by jesus
christ, and god the father, who rais him from the dead;) 1:2 and all
th brethren which are with me, unto the church of galatia: 1:3
grace be to you and peac from god the father, and from our lord jesus
christ, 1:4 who gave himself for our sins, that he might deliv us
from thi present evil world, accord to the will of god and our
father: 1:5 To whom be glori for ever and ever. amen.

1:6 I marvel that ye are so soon remov from him that call you into
th grace of christ unto anoth gospel: 1:7 which is not another; but
ther be some that troubl you, and would pervert the gospel of
christ.

1:8 but though we, or an angel from heaven, preach ani other gospel
unto you than that which we have preach unto you, let him be
accursed.

1:9 As we said before, so say I now again, if ani man preach ani other
gospel unto you than that ye have received, let him be accursed.

1:10 for do I now persuad men, or god? or do I seek to pleas men?
for if I yet pleas men, I should not be the servant of christ.

1:11 but I certifi you, brethren, that the gospel which wa preached
of me is not after man.

1:12 for I neither receiv it of man, neither wa I taught it, but by
th revel of jesu christ.

1:13 for ye have heard of my convers in time past in the jews'
religion, how that beyond measur I persecut the church of god, and
wast it: 1:14 and profit in the jews' religion abov mani my
equ in mine own nation, be more exceedingli zealou of the
tradit of my fathers.

1:15 but when it pleas god, who separ me from my mother' womb,
and call me by hi grace, 1:16 To reveal hi son in me, that I might
preach him among the heathen; immedi I confer not with flesh
and blood: 1:17 neither went I up to jerusalem to them which were
apostl befor me; but I went into arabia, and return again unto
damascus.

1:18 then after three year I went up to jerusalem to see peter, and
abod with him fifteen days.

1:19 but other of the apostl saw I none, save jame the lord's
brother.

1:20 now the thing which I write unto you, behold, befor god, I lie
not.

1:21 afterward I came into the region of syria and cilicia; 1:22 and
wa unknown by face unto the church of judaea which were in christ:
1:23 but they had heard only, that he which persecut us in times
past now preacheth the faith which onc he destroyed.

1:24 and they glorifi god in me.

2:1 then fourteen year after I went up again to jerusalem with
barnabas, and took titu with me also.

2:2 and I went up by revelation, and commun unto them that
gospel which I preach among the gentiles, but privat to them which
wer of reputation, lest by ani mean I should run, or had run, in
vain.

2:3 but neither titus, who wa with me, be a greek, wa compelled
to be circumcised: 2:4 and that becaus of fals brethren unawares
brought in, who came in privili to spi out our liberti which we have
in christ jesus, that they might bring us into bondage: 2:5 To whom we
gav place by subjection, no, not for an hour; that the truth of the
gospel might continu with you.

2:6 but of these who seem to be somewhat, (whatsoev they were, it
maketh no matter to me: god accepteth no man' person:) for they who
seem to be somewhat in confer ad noth to me: 2:7 but
contrariwise, when they saw that the gospel of the uncircumcis was
commit unto me, as the gospel of the circumcis wa unto peter;
2:8 (for he that wrought effectu in peter to the apostleship of
th circumcision, the same wa mighti in me toward the gentiles:) 2:9
and when james, cephas, and john, who seem to be pillars, perceived
th grace that wa given unto me, they gave to me and barnaba the
right hand of fellowship; that we should go unto the heathen, and
they unto the circumcision.

2:10 onli they would that we should rememb the poor; the same which
i also wa forward to do.

2:11 but when peter wa come to antioch, I withstood him to the face,
becaus he wa to be blamed.

2:12 for befor that certain came from james, he did eat with the
gentiles: but when they were come, he withdrew and separ himself,
fear them which were of the circumcision.

2:13 and the other jew dissembl likewis with him; insomuch that
barnaba also wa carri away with their dissimulation.

2:14 but when I saw that they walk not uprightli accord to the
truth of the gospel, I said unto peter befor them all, If thou, being
a jew, livest after the manner of gentiles, and not as do the jews,
whi compellest thou the gentil to live as do the jews?  2:15 We who
ar jew by nature, and not sinner of the gentiles, 2:16 know that
a man is not justifi by the work of the law, but by the faith of
jesu christ, even we have believ in jesu christ, that we might be
justifi by the faith of christ, and not by the work of the law: for
bi the work of the law shall no flesh be justified.

2:17 but if, while we seek to be justifi by christ, we ourselves
also are found sinners, is therefor christ the minist of sin? god
forbid.

2:18 for if I build again the thing which I destroyed, I make myself
a transgressor.

2:19 for I through the law am dead to the law, that I might live unto
god.

2:20 I am crucifi with christ: neverthless I live; yet not I, but
christ liveth in me: and the life which I now live in the flesh I live
bi the faith of the son of god, who love me, and gave himself for me.

2:21 I do not frustrat the grace of god: for if righteous come by
th law, then christ is dead in vain.

3:1 O foolish galatians, who hath bewitch you, that ye should not
obey the truth, befor whose eye jesu christ hath been evid set
forth, crucifi among you?  3:2 thi onli would I learn of you,
receiv ye the spirit by the work of the law, or by the hear of
faith?  3:3 are ye so foolish? have begun in the spirit, are ye now
mad perfect by the flesh?  3:4 have ye suffer so mani thing in
vain? if it be yet in vain.

3:5 He therefor that ministereth to you the spirit, and worketh
miracl among you, doeth he it by the work of the law, or by the
hear of faith?  3:6 even as abraham believ god, and it was
account to him for righteousness.

3:7 know ye therefor that they which are of faith, the same are the
children of abraham.

3:8 and the scripture, forese that god would justifi the heathen
through faith, preach befor the gospel unto abraham, saying, in
the shall all nation be blessed.

3:9 So then they which be of faith are bless with faith abraham.

3:10 for as mani as are of the work of the law are under the curse:
for it is written, curs is everi one that continueth not in all
th which are written in the book of the law to do them.

3:11 but that no man is justifi by the law in the sight of god, it
i evident: for, the just shall live by faith.

3:12 and the law is not of faith: but, the man that doeth them shall
liv in them.

3:13 christ hath redeem us from the curs of the law, be made a
curs for us: for it is written, curs is everi one that hangeth on a
tree: 3:14 that the bless of abraham might come on the gentiles
through jesu christ; that we might receiv the promis of the spirit
through faith.

3:15 brethren, I speak after the manner of men; though it be but a
man' covenant, yet if it be confirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth
thereto.

3:16 now to abraham and hi seed were the promis made. He saith not,
and to seeds, as of many; but as of one, and to thi seed, which is
christ.

3:17 and thi I say, that the covenant, that wa confirm befor of
god in christ, the law, which wa four hundr and thirti year after,
cannot disannul, that it should make the promis of none effect.

3:18 for if the inherit be of the law, it is no more of promise:
but god gave it to abraham by promise.

3:19 wherefor then serveth the law? It wa ad becaus of
transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promis was
made; and it wa ordain by angel in the hand of a mediator.

3:20 now a mediat is not a mediat of one, but god is one.

3:21 Is the law then against the promis of god? god forbid: for if
ther had been a law given which could have given life, verily
right should have been by the law.

3:22 but the scriptur hath conclud all under sin, that the promise
bi faith of jesu christ might be given to them that believe.

3:23 but befor faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto
th faith which should afterward be revealed.

3:24 wherefor the law wa our schoolmast to bring us unto christ,
that we might be justifi by faith.

3:25 but after that faith is come, we are no longer under a
schoolmaster.

3:26 for ye are all the children of god by faith in christ jesus.

3:27 for as mani of you as have been baptiz into christ have put on
christ.

3:28 there is neither jew nor greek, there is neither bond nor free,
ther is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in christ jesus.

3:29 and if ye be christ's, then are ye abraham' seed, and heirs
accord to the promise.

4:1 now I say, that the heir, as long as he is a child, differeth
noth from a servant, though he be lord of all; 4:2 but is under
tutor and governor until the time appoint of the father.

4:3 even so we, when we were children, were in bondag under the
el of the world: 4:4 but when the ful of the time wa come,
god sent forth hi son, made of a woman, made under the law, 4:5 to
redeem them that were under the law, that we might receiv the
adopt of sons.

4:6 and becaus ye are sons, god hath sent forth the spirit of hi son
into your hearts, crying, abba, father.

4:7 wherefor thou art no more a servant, but a son; and if a son,
then an heir of god through christ.

4:8 howbeit then, when ye knew not god, ye did servic unto them which
bi natur are no gods.

4:9 but now, after that ye have known god, or rather are known of god,
how turn ye again to the weak and beggarli elements, whereunto ye
desir again to be in bondage?  4:10 Ye observ days, and months, and
times, and years.

4:11 I am afraid of you, lest I have bestow upon you labour in vain.

4:12 brethren, I beseech you, be as I am; for I am as ye are: ye have
not injur me at all.

4:13 Ye know how through infirm of the flesh I preach the gospel
unto you at the first.

4:14 and my temptat which wa in my flesh ye despis not, nor
rejected; but receiv me as an angel of god, even as christ jesus.

4:15 where is then the blessed ye spake of? for I bear you record,
that, if it had been possible, ye would have pluck out your own
eyes, and have given them to me.

4:16 Am I therefor becom your enemy, becaus I tell you the truth?
4:17 they zealous affect you, but not well; yea, they would exclude
you, that ye might affect them.

4:18 but it is good to be zealous affect alway in a good thing,
and not onli when I am present with you.

4:19 My littl children, of whom I travail in birth again until christ
b form in you, 4:20 I desir to be present with you now, and to
chang my voice; for I stand in doubt of you.

4:21 tell me, ye that desir to be under the law, do ye not hear the
law?  4:22 for it is written, that abraham had two sons, the one by a
bondmaid, the other by a freewoman.

4:23 but he who wa of the bondwoman wa born after the flesh; but he
of the freewoman wa by promise.

4:24 which thing are an allegory: for these are the two covenants;
th one from the mount sinai, which gendereth to bondage, which is
agar.

4:25 for thi agar is mount sinai in arabia, and answereth to
jerusalem which now is, and is in bondag with her children.

4:26 but jerusalem which is abov is free, which is the mother of us
all.

4:27 for it is written, rejoice, thou barren that bearest not; break
forth and cry, thou that travailest not: for the desol hath many
mor children than she which hath an husband.

4:28 now we, brethren, as isaac was, are the children of promise.

4:29 but as then he that wa born after the flesh persecut him that
wa born after the spirit, even so it is now.

4:30 nevertheless what saith the scripture? cast out the bondwoman and
her son: for the son of the bondwoman shall not be heir with the son
of the freewoman.

4:31 So then, brethren, we are not children of the bondwoman, but of
th free.

5:1 stand fast therefor in the liberti wherewith christ hath made us
free, and be not entangl again with the yoke of bondage.

5:2 behold, I paul say unto you, that if ye be circumcised, christ
shal profit you nothing.

5:3 for I testifi again to everi man that is circumcised, that he is a
debtor to do the whole law.

5:4 christ is becom of no effect unto you, whosoev of you are
justifi by the law; ye are fallen from grace.

5:5 for we through the spirit wait for the hope of righteous by
faith.

5:6 for in jesu christ neither circumcis availeth ani thing, nor
uncircumcision; but faith which worketh by love.

5:7 Ye did run well; who did hinder you that ye should not obey the
truth?  5:8 thi persuas cometh not of him that calleth you.

5:9 A littl leaven leaveneth the whole lump.

5:10 I have confid in you through the lord, that ye will be none
otherwis minded: but he that troubleth you shall bear hi judgment,
whosoev he be.

5:11 and I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, whi do I yet
suff persecution? then is the offenc of the cross ceased.

5:12 I would they were even cut off which troubl you.

5:13 for, brethren, ye have been call unto liberty; onli use not
liberti for an occas to the flesh, but by love serv one another.

5:14 for all the law is fulfil in one word, even in this; thou
shalt love thi neighbour as thyself.

5:15 but if ye bite and devour one another, take heed that ye be not
consum one of another.

5:16 thi I say then, walk in the spirit, and ye shall not fulfil the
lust of the flesh.

5:17 for the flesh lusteth against the spirit, and the spirit against
th flesh: and these are contrari the one to the other: so that ye
cannot do the thing that ye would.

5:18 but if ye be led of the spirit, ye are not under the law.

5:19 now the work of the flesh are manifest, which are these;
adultery, fornication, uncleanness, lasciviousness, 5:20 idolatry,
witchcraft, hatred, variance, emulations, wrath, strife, seditions,
heresies, 5:21 envyings, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such
like: of the which I tell you before, as I have also told you in time
past, that they which do such thing shall not inherit the kingdom of
god.

5:22 but the fruit of the spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering,
gentleness, goodness, faith, 5:23 meekness, temperance: against such
ther is no law.

5:24 and they that are christ' have crucifi the flesh with the
affect and lusts.

5:25 If we live in the spirit, let us also walk in the spirit.

5:26 let us not be desir of vain glory, provok one another,
envi one another.

6:1 brethren, if a man be overtaken in a fault, ye which are
spiritual, restor such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering
thyself, lest thou also be tempted.

6:2 bear ye one another' burdens, and so fulfil the law of christ.

6:3 for if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he
deceiveth himself.

6:4 but let everi man prove hi own work, and then shall he have
rejo in himself alone, and not in another.

6:5 for everi man shall bear hi own burden.

6:6 let him that is taught in the word commun unto him that
teacheth in all good things.

6:7 Be not deceived; god is not mocked: for whatsoev a man soweth,
that shall he also reap.

6:8 for he that soweth to hi flesh shall of the flesh reap
corruption; but he that soweth to the spirit shall of the spirit reap
lif everlasting.

6:9 and let us not be weari in well doing: for in due season we shall
reap, if we faint not.

6:10 As we have therefor opportunity, let us do good unto all men,
especi unto them who are of the household of faith.

6:11 Ye see how larg a letter I have written unto you with mine own
hand.

6:12 As mani as desir to make a fair shew in the flesh, they
constrain you to be circumcised; onli lest they should suffer
persecut for the cross of christ.

6:13 for neither they themselv who are circumcis keep the law; but
desir to have you circumcised, that they may glori in your flesh.

6:14 but god forbid that I should glory, save in the cross of our lord
jesu christ, by whom the world is crucifi unto me, and I unto the
world.

6:15 for in christ jesu neither circumcis availeth ani thing, nor
uncircumcision, but a new creature.

6:16 and as mani as walk accord to thi rule, peac be on them, and
mercy, and upon the israel of god.

6:17 from henceforth let no man troubl me: for I bear in my bodi the
mark of the lord jesus.

6:18 brethren, the grace of our lord jesu christ be with your spirit.

amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the ephesians


1:1 paul, an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god, to the
saint which are at ephesus, and to the faith in christ jesus:
1:2 grace be to you, and peace, from god our father, and from the lord
jesu christ.

1:3 bless be the god and father of our lord jesu christ, who hath
bless us with all spiritu bless in heavenli place in christ:
1:4 accord as he hath chosen us in him befor the foundat of the
world, that we should be holi and without blame befor him in love:
1:5 have predestin us unto the adopt of children by jesus
christ to himself, accord to the good pleasur of hi will, 1:6 to
th prais of the glori of hi grace, wherein he hath made us accepted
in the beloved.

1:7 In whom we have redempt through hi blood, the forgiv of
sins, accord to the rich of hi grace; 1:8 wherein he hath
abound toward us in all wisdom and prudence; 1:9 have made known
unto us the mysteri of hi will, accord to hi good pleasur which
h hath purpos in himself: 1:10 that in the dispens of the
 of time he might gather togeth in one all thing in christ,
both which are in heaven, and which are on earth; even in him: 1:11 in
whom also we have obtain an inheritance, be predestinated
accord to the purpos of him who worketh all thing after the
counsel of hi own will: 1:12 that we should be to the prais of his
glory, who first trust in christ.

1:13 In whom ye also trusted, after that ye heard the word of truth,
th gospel of your salvation: in whom also after that ye believed, ye
wer seal with that holi spirit of promise, 1:14 which is the
earnest of our inherit until the redempt of the purchased
possession, unto the prais of hi glory.

1:15 wherefor I also, after I heard of your faith in the lord jesus,
and love unto all the saints, 1:16 ceas not to give thank for you,
mak mention of you in my prayers; 1:17 that the god of our lord
jesu christ, the father of glory, may give unto you the spirit of
wisdom and revel in the knowledg of him: 1:18 the eye of your
understand be enlightened; that ye may know what is the hope of
hi calling, and what the rich of the glori of hi inherit in
th saints, 1:19 and what is the exceed great of hi power to
us-ward who believe, accord to the work of hi mighti power,
1:20 which he wrought in christ, when he rais him from the dead, and
set him at hi own right hand in the heavenli places, 1:21 far above
al principality, and power, and might, and dominion, and everi name
that is named, not onli in thi world, but also in that which is to
come: 1:22 and hath put all thing under hi feet, and gave him to be
th head over all thing to the church, 1:23 which is hi body, the
 of him that filleth all in all.

2:1 and you hath he quickened, who were dead in trespass and sins;
2:2 wherein in time past ye walk accord to the cours of this
world, accord to the princ of the power of the air, the spirit
that now worketh in the children of disobedience: 2:3 among whom also
w all had our convers in time past in the lust of our flesh,
fulfil the desir of the flesh and of the mind; and were by
natur the children of wrath, even as others.

2:4 but god, who is rich in mercy, for hi great love wherewith he
lov us, 2:5 even when we were dead in sins, hath quicken us
togeth with christ, (bi grace ye are saved;) 2:6 and hath rais us
up together, and made us sit togeth in heavenli place in christ
jesus: 2:7 that in the age to come he might shew the exceed riches
of hi grace in hi kind toward us through christ jesus.

2:8 for by grace are ye save through faith; and that not of
yourselves: it is the gift of god: 2:9 not of works, lest ani man
should boast.

2:10 for we are hi workmanship, creat in christ jesu unto good
works, which god hath befor ordain that we should walk in them.

2:11 wherefor remember, that ye be in time past gentil in the
flesh, who are call uncircumcis by that which is call the
circumcis in the flesh made by hands; 2:12 that at that time ye
wer without christ, be alien from the commonwealth of israel, and
strang from the coven of promise, have no hope, and without
god in the world: 2:13 but now in christ jesu ye who sometim were
far off are made nigh by the blood of christ.

2:14 for he is our peace, who hath made both one, and hath broken down
th middl wall of partit between us; 2:15 have abolish in his
flesh the enmity, even the law of command contain in
ordinances; for to make in himself of twain one new man, so making
peace; 2:16 and that he might reconcil both unto god in one bodi by
th cross, have slain the enmiti thereby: 2:17 and came and preached
peac to you which were afar off, and to them that were nigh.

2:18 for through him we both have access by one spirit unto the
father.

2:19 now therefor ye are no more stranger and foreigners, but
fellowcitizen with the saints, and of the household of god; 2:20 and
ar built upon the foundat of the apostl and prophets, jesus
christ himself be the chief corner stone; 2:21 In whom all the
build fitli frame togeth groweth unto an holi templ in the
lord: 2:22 In whom ye also are build togeth for an habit of
god through the spirit.

3:1 for thi caus I paul, the prison of jesu christ for you
gentiles, 3:2 If ye have heard of the dispens of the grace of god
which is given me to you-ward: 3:3 how that by revel he made
known unto me the mystery; (a I wrote afor in few words, 3:4
whereby, when ye read, ye may understand my knowledg in the mystery
of christ) 3:5 which in other age wa not made known unto the son of
men, as it is now reveal unto hi holi apostl and prophet by the
spirit; 3:6 that the gentil should be fellowheirs, and of the same
body, and partak of hi promis in christ by the gospel: 3:7
whereof I wa made a minister, accord to the gift of the grace of
god given unto me by the effectu work of hi power.

3:8 unto me, who am less than the least of all saints, is thi grace
given, that I should preach among the gentil the unsearch riches
of christ; 3:9 and to make all men see what is the fellowship of the
mystery, which from the begin of the world hath been hid in god,
who creat all thing by jesu christ: 3:10 To the intent that now
unto the princip and power in heavenli place might be known
bi the church the manifold wisdom of god, 3:11 accord to the
etern purpos which he purpos in christ jesu our lord: 3:12 in
whom we have bold and access with confid by the faith of him.

3:13 wherefor I desir that ye faint not at my tribul for you,
which is your glory.

3:14 for thi caus I bow my knee unto the father of our lord jesus
christ, 3:15 Of whom the whole famili in heaven and earth is named,
3:16 that he would grant you, accord to the rich of hi glory, to
b strengthen with might by hi spirit in the inner man; 3:17 that
christ may dwell in your heart by faith; that ye, be root and
ground in love, 3:18 may be abl to comprehend with all saint what
i the breadth, and length, and depth, and height; 3:19 and to know
th love of christ, which passeth knowledge, that ye might be filled
with all the ful of god.

3:20 now unto him that is abl to do exceed abundantli abov all
that we ask or think, accord to the power that worketh in us, 3:21
unto him be glori in the church by christ jesu throughout all ages,
world without end. amen.

4:1 I therefore, the prison of the lord, beseech you that ye walk
worthi of the vocat wherewith ye are called, 4:2 with all lowliness
and meekness, with longsuffering, forbear one anoth in love; 4:3
endeavour to keep the uniti of the spirit in the bond of peace.

4:4 there is one body, and one spirit, even as ye are call in one
hop of your calling; 4:5 one lord, one faith, one baptism, 4:6 one
god and father of all, who is abov all, and through all, and in you
all.

4:7 but unto everi one of us is given grace accord to the measure
of the gift of christ.

4:8 wherefor he saith, when he ascend up on high, he led captivity
captive, and gave gift unto men.

4:9 (now that he ascended, what is it but that he also descend first
into the lower part of the earth?  4:10 He that descend is the same
also that ascend up far abov all heavens, that he might fill all
things.)  4:11 and he gave some, apostles; and some, prophets; and
some, evangelists; and some, pastor and teachers; 4:12 for the
perfect of the saints, for the work of the ministry, for the
edifi of the bodi of christ: 4:13 till we all come in the uniti of
th faith, and of the knowledg of the son of god, unto a perfect man,
unto the measur of the statur of the ful of christ: 4:14 that we
henceforth be no more children, toss to and fro, and carri about
with everi wind of doctrine, by the sleight of men, and cunning
craftiness, wherebi they lie in wait to deceive; 4:15 but speak the
truth in love, may grow up into him in all things, which is the head,
even christ: 4:16 from whom the whole bodi fitli join togeth and
compact by that which everi joint supplieth, accord to the
effectu work in the measur of everi part, maketh increas of the
bodi unto the edifi of itself in love.

4:17 thi I say therefore, and testifi in the lord, that ye henceforth
walk not as other gentil walk, in the vaniti of their mind, 4:18
have the understand darkened, be alien from the life of
god through the ignor that is in them, becaus of the blind of
their heart: 4:19 who be past feel have given themselv over
unto lasciviousness, to work all unclean with greediness.

4:20 but ye have not so learn christ; 4:21 If so be that ye have
heard him, and have been taught by him, as the truth is in jesus: 4:22
that ye put off concern the former convers the old man, which
i corrupt accord to the deceit lusts; 4:23 and be renew in
th spirit of your mind; 4:24 and that ye put on the new man, which
aft god is creat in righteous and true holiness.

4:25 wherefor put away lying, speak everi man truth with his
neighbour: for we are member one of another.

4:26 Be ye angry, and sin not: let not the sun go down upon your
wrath: 4:27 neither give place to the devil.

4:28 let him that stole steal no more: but rather let him labour,
work with hi hand the thing which is good, that he may have to
giv to him that needeth.

4:29 let no corrupt commun proceed out of your mouth, but that
which is good to the use of edifying, that it may minist grace unto
th hearers.

4:30 and griev not the holi spirit of god, wherebi ye are seal unto
th day of redemption.

4:31 let all bitterness, and wrath, and anger, and clamour, and evil
speaking, be put away from you, with all malice: 4:32 and be ye kind
on to another, tenderhearted, forgiv one another, even as god for
christ' sake hath forgiven you.

5:1 Be ye therefor follow of god, as dear children; 5:2 and walk
in love, as christ also hath love us, and hath given himself for us
an offer and a sacrific to god for a sweetsmel savour.

5:3 but fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not
b onc name among you, as becometh saints; 5:4 neither filthiness,
nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather
giv of thanks.

5:5 for thi ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor
covet man, who is an idolater, hath ani inherit in the kingdom
of christ and of god.

5:6 let no man deceiv you with vain words: for becaus of these
th cometh the wrath of god upon the children of disobedience.

5:7 Be not ye therefor partak with them.

5:8 for ye were sometim darkness, but now are ye light in the lord:
walk as children of light: 5:9 (for the fruit of the spirit is in all
good and righteous and truth;) 5:10 prove what is acceptable
unto the lord.

5:11 and have no fellowship with the unfruit work of darkness, but
rath reprov them.

5:12 for it is a shame even to speak of those thing which are done of
them in secret.

5:13 but all thing that are reprov are made manifest by the light:
for whatsoev doth make manifest is light.

5:14 wherefor he saith, awak thou that sleepest, and aris from the
dead, and christ shall give thee light.

5:15 see then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,
5:16 redeem the time, becaus the day are evil.

5:17 wherefor be ye not unwise, but understand what the will of
th lord is.

5:18 and be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be fill with
th spirit; 5:19 speak to yourselv in psalm and hymn and
spiritu songs, sing and make melodi in your heart to the lord;
5:20 give thank alway for all thing unto god and the father in
th name of our lord jesu christ; 5:21 submit yourselv one to
anoth in the fear of god.

5:22 wives, submit yourselv unto your own husbands, as unto the
lord.

5:23 for the husband is the head of the wife, even as christ is the
head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.

5:24 therefor as the church is subject unto christ, so let the wives
b to their own husband in everi thing.

5:25 husbands, love your wives, even as christ also love the church,
and gave himself for it; 5:26 that he might sanctifi and cleans it
with the wash of water by the word, 5:27 that he might present it
to himself a gloriou church, not have spot, or wrinkle, or ani such
thing; but that it should be holi and without blemish.

5:28 So ought men to love their wive as their own bodies. He that
loveth hi wife loveth himself.

5:29 for no man ever yet hate hi own flesh; but nourisheth and
cherisheth it, even as the lord the church: 5:30 for we are member of
hi body, of hi flesh, and of hi bones.

5:31 for thi caus shall a man leav hi father and mother, and shall
b join unto hi wife, and they two shall be one flesh.

5:32 thi is a great mystery: but I speak concern christ and the
church.

5:33 nevertheless let everi one of you in particular so love hi wife
even as himself; and the wife see that she rever her husband.

6:1 children, obey your parent in the lord: for thi is right.

6:2 honour thi father and mother; which is the first command with
promise; 6:3 that it may be well with thee, and thou mayest live long
on the earth.

6:4 and, ye fathers, provok not your children to wrath: but bring
them up in the nurtur and admonit of the lord.

6:5 servants, be obedi to them that are your master accord to
th flesh, with fear and trembling, in singl of your heart, as
unto christ; 6:6 not with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but as the
serv of christ, do the will of god from the heart; 6:7 with
good will do service, as to the lord, and not to men: 6:8 knowing
that whatsoev good thing ani man doeth, the same shall he receiv of
th lord, whether he be bond or free.

6:9 and, ye masters, do the same thing unto them, forbearing
threatening: know that your master also is in heaven; neither is
ther respect of person with him.

6:10 finally, my brethren, be strong in the lord, and in the power of
hi might.

6:11 put on the whole armour of god, that ye may be abl to stand
against the wile of the devil.

6:12 for we wrestl not against flesh and blood, but against
principalities, against powers, against the ruler of the dark of
thi world, against spiritu wicked in high places.

6:13 wherefor take unto you the whole armour of god, that ye may be
abl to withstand in the evil day, and have done all, to stand.

6:14 stand therefore, have your loin girt about with truth, and
hav on the breastplat of righteousness; 6:15 and your feet shod
with the prepar of the gospel of peace; 6:16 abov all, taking
th shield of faith, wherewith ye shall be abl to quench all the
fieri dart of the wicked.

6:17 and take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the spirit,
which is the word of god: 6:18 pray alway with all prayer and
suppl in the spirit, and watch thereunto with all
persever and supplic for all saints; 6:19 and for me, that
utter may be given unto me, that I may open my mouth boldly, to
mak known the mysteri of the gospel, 6:20 for which I am an
ambassador in bonds: that therein I may speak boldly, as I ought to
speak.

6:21 but that ye also may know my affairs, and how I do, tychicus, a
belov brother and faith minist in the lord, shall make known to
you all things: 6:22 whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose,
that ye might know our affairs, and that he might comfort your hearts.

6:23 peac be to the brethren, and love with faith, from god the
fath and the lord jesu christ.

6:24 grace be with all them that love our lord jesu christ in
sincerity.

amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the philippians


1:1 paul and timotheus, the servant of jesu christ, to all the
saint in christ jesu which are at philippi, with the bishop and
deacons: 1:2 grace be unto you, and peace, from god our father, and
from the lord jesu christ.

1:3 I thank my god upon everi remembr of you, 1:4 alway in every
pray of mine for you all make request with joy, 1:5 for your
fellowship in the gospel from the first day until now; 1:6 being
confid of thi veri thing, that he which hath begun a good work in
you will perform it until the day of jesu christ: 1:7 even as it is
meet for me to think thi of you all, becaus I have you in my heart;
inasmuch as both in my bonds, and in the defenc and confirm of
th gospel, ye all are partak of my grace.

1:8 for god is my record, how greatli I long after you all in the
bowel of jesu christ.

1:9 and thi I pray, that your love may abound yet more and more in
knowledg and in all judgment; 1:10 that ye may approv thing that
ar excellent; that ye may be sincer and without offenc till the day
of christ.

1:11 be fill with the fruit of righteousness, which are by jesus
christ, unto the glori and prais of god.

1:12 but I would ye should understand, brethren, that the thing which
happen unto me have fallen out rather unto the further of the
gospel; 1:13 So that my bond in christ are manifest in all the
palace, and in all other places; 1:14 and mani of the brethren in the
lord, wax confid by my bonds, are much more bold to speak the
word without fear.

1:15 some inde preach christ even of envi and strife; and some also
of good will: 1:16 the one preach christ of contention, not sincerely,
suppos to add afflict to my bonds: 1:17 but the other of love,
know that I am set for the defenc of the gospel.

1:18 what then? notwithstanding, everi way, whether in pretence, or in
truth, christ is preached; and I therein do rejoice, yea, and will
rejoice.

1:19 for I know that thi shall turn to my salvat through your
prayer, and the suppli of the spirit of jesu christ, 1:20 according
to my earnest expect and my hope, that in noth I shall be
ashamed, but that with all boldness, as always, so now also christ
shal be magnifi in my body, whether it be by life, or by death.

1:21 for to me to live is christ, and to die is gain.

1:22 but if I live in the flesh, thi is the fruit of my labour: yet
what I shall choos I wot not.

1:23 for I am in a strait betwixt two, have a desir to depart, and
to be with christ; which is far better: 1:24 nevertheless to abid in
th flesh is more need for you.

1:25 and have thi confidence, I know that I shall abid and
continu with you all for your further and joy of faith; 1:26 that
your rejoic may be more abund in jesu christ for me by my
com to you again.

1:27 onli let your convers be as it becometh the gospel of
christ: that whether I come and see you, or els be absent, I may hear
of your affairs, that ye stand fast in one spirit, with one mind
striv togeth for the faith of the gospel; 1:28 and in nothing
terrifi by your adversaries: which is to them an evid token of
perdition, but to you of salvation, and that of god.

1:29 for unto you it is given in the behalf of christ, not onli to
believ on him, but also to suffer for hi sake; 1:30 have the same
conflict which ye saw in me, and now hear to be in me.

2:1 If there be therefor ani consol in christ, if ani comfort of
love, if ani fellowship of the spirit, if ani bowel and mercies, 2:2
fulfil ye my joy, that ye be likeminded, have the same love, being
of one accord, of one mind.

2:3 let noth be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness
of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

2:4 look not everi man on hi own things, but everi man also on the
th of others.

2:5 let thi mind be in you, which wa also in christ jesus: 2:6 who,
b in the form of god, thought it not robberi to be equal with god:
2:7 but made himself of no reputation, and took upon him the form of a
servant, and wa made in the like of men: 2:8 and be found in
fashion as a man, he humbl himself, and becam obedi unto death,
even the death of the cross.

2:9 wherefor god also hath highli exalt him, and given him a name
which is abov everi name: 2:10 that at the name of jesu everi knee
should bow, of thing in heaven, and thing in earth, and thing under
th earth; 2:11 and that everi tongu should confess that jesu christ
i lord, to the glori of god the father.

2:12 wherefore, my beloved, as ye have alway obeyed, not as in my
pres only, but now much more in my absence, work out your own
salv with fear and trembling.

2:13 for it is god which worketh in you both to will and to do of his
good pleasure.

2:14 Do all thing without murmur and disputings: 2:15 that ye may
b blameless and harmless, the son of god, without rebuke, in the
midst of a crook and pervers nation, among whom ye shine as lights
in the world; 2:16 hold forth the word of life; that I may rejoice
in the day of christ, that I have not run in vain, neither labour in
vain.

2:17 yea, and if I be offer upon the sacrific and servic of your
faith, I joy, and rejoic with you all.

2:18 for the same caus also do ye joy, and rejoic with me.

2:19 but I trust in the lord jesu to send timotheu shortli unto you,
that I also may be of good comfort, when I know your state.

2:20 for I have no man likeminded, who will natur care for your
state.

2:21 for all seek their own, not the thing which are jesu christ's.

2:22 but ye know the proof of him, that, as a son with the father, he
hath serv with me in the gospel.

2:23 him therefor I hope to send presently, so soon as I shall see
how it will go with me.

2:24 but I trust in the lord that I also myself shall come shortly.

2:25 yet I suppos it necessari to send to you epaphroditus, my
brother, and companion in labour, and fellowsoldier, but your
messenger, and he that minist to my wants.

2:26 for he long after you all, and wa full of heaviness, because
that ye had heard that he had been sick.

2:27 for inde he wa sick nigh unto death: but god had merci on him;
and not on him only, but on me also, lest I should have sorrow upon
sorrow.

2:28 I sent him therefor the more carefully, that, when ye see him
again, ye may rejoice, and that I may be the less sorrowful.

2:29 receiv him therefor in the lord with all gladness; and hold
such in reputation: 2:30 becaus for the work of christ he wa nigh
unto death, not regard hi life, to suppli your lack of service
toward me.

3:1 finally, my brethren, rejoic in the lord. To write the same
th to you, to me inde is not grievous, but for you it is safe.

3:2 bewar of dogs, bewar of evil workers, bewar of the concision.

3:3 for we are the circumcision, which worship god in the spirit, and
rejoic in christ jesus, and have no confid in the flesh.

3:4 though I might also have confid in the flesh. If ani other man
thinketh that he hath whereof he might trust in the flesh, I more: 3:5
circumcis the eighth day, of the stock of israel, of the tribe of
benjamin, an hebrew of the hebrews; as touch the law, a pharisee;
3:6 concern zeal, persecut the church; touch the
right which is in the law, blameless.

3:7 but what thing were gain to me, those I count loss for christ.

3:8 yea doubtless, and I count all thing but loss for the excellency
of the knowledg of christ jesu my lord: for whom I have suffer the
loss of all things, and do count them but dung, that I may win christ,
3:9 and be found in him, not have mine own righteousness, which is
of the law, but that which is through the faith of christ, the
right which is of god by faith: 3:10 that I may know him, and
th power of hi resurrection, and the fellowship of hi sufferings,
b made conform unto hi death; 3:11 If by ani mean I might
attain unto the resurrect of the dead.

3:12 not as though I had alreadi attained, either were already
perfect: but I follow after, if that I may apprehend that for which
also I am apprehend of christ jesus.

3:13 brethren, I count not myself to have apprehended: but thi one
th I do, forget those thing which are behind, and reaching
forth unto those thing which are before, 3:14 I press toward the mark
for the prize of the high call of god in christ jesus.

3:15 let us therefore, as mani as be perfect, be thu minded: and if
in ani thing ye be otherwis minded, god shall reveal even thi unto
you.

3:16 nevertheless, whereto we have alreadi attained, let us walk by
th same rule, let us mind the same thing.

3:17 brethren, be follow togeth of me, and mark them which walk
so as ye have us for an ensample.

3:18 (for mani walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you
even weeping, that they are the enemi of the cross of christ: 3:19
whose end is destruction, whose god is their belly, and whose glori is
in their shame, who mind earthli things.)  3:20 for our conversation
i in heaven; from whenc also we look for the saviour, the lord jesus
christ: 3:21 who shall chang our vile body, that it may be fashioned
lik unto hi gloriou body, accord to the work wherebi he is
abl even to subdu all thing unto himself.

4:1 therefore, my brethren dearli belov and long for, my joy and
crown, so stand fast in the lord, my dearli beloved.

4:2 I beseech euodias, and beseech syntyche, that they be of the same
mind in the lord.

4:3 and I intreat thee also, true yokefellow, help those women which
labour with me in the gospel, with clement also, and with other my
fellowlabourers, whose name are in the book of life.

4:4 rejoic in the lord alway: and again I say, rejoice.

4:5 let your moder be known unto all men. the lord is at hand.

4:6 Be care for nothing; but in everi thing by prayer and
suppl with thanksgiv let your request be made known unto
god.

4:7 and the peac of god, which passeth all understanding, shall keep
your heart and mind through christ jesus.

4:8 finally, brethren, whatsoev thing are true, whatsoev things
ar honest, whatsoev thing are just, whatsoev thing are pure,
whatsoev thing are lovely, whatsoev thing are of good report; if
ther be ani virtue, and if there be ani praise, think on these
things.

4:9 those things, which ye have both learned, and received, and heard,
and seen in me, do: and the god of peac shall be with you.

4:10 but I rejoic in the lord greatly, that now at the last your
car of me hath flourish again; wherein ye were also careful, but ye
lack opportunity.

4:11 not that I speak in respect of want: for I have learned, in
whatsoev state I am, therewith to be content.

4:12 I know both how to be abased, and I know how to abound: every
wher and in all thing I am instruct both to be full and to be
hungry, both to abound and to suffer need.

4:13 I can do all thing through christ which strengtheneth me.

4:14 notwithstand ye have well done, that ye did commun with
mi affliction.

4:15 now ye philippian know also, that in the begin of the
gospel, when I depart from macedonia, no church commun with me
a concern give and receiving, but ye only.

4:16 for even in thessalonica ye sent onc and again unto my
necessity.

4:17 not becaus I desir a gift: but I desir fruit that may abound
to your account.

4:18 but I have all, and abound: I am full, have receiv of
epaphroditu the thing which were sent from you, an odour of a sweet
smell, a sacrific acceptable, wellpleas to god.

4:19 but my god shall suppli all your need accord to hi rich in
glori by christ jesus.

4:20 now unto god and our father be glori for ever and ever. amen.

4:21 salut everi saint in christ jesus. the brethren which are with
m greet you.

4:22 all the saint salut you, chiefli they that are of caesar's
household.

4:23 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all. amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the colossians


1:1  paul, an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god,
and timotheu our brother, 1:2  To the saint and faith brethren
in christ which are at colosse: grace be unto you, and peace,
from god our father and the lord jesu christ.

1:3  We give thank to god and the father of our lord jesu christ, praying
alway for you,
1:4  sinc we heard of your faith in christ jesus, and of the love which ye
hav to all the saints,
1:5  for the hope which is laid up for you in heaven, whereof ye heard
befor in the word of the truth of the gospel;
1:6  which is come unto you, as it is in all the world; and bringeth forth
fruit, as it doth also in you, sinc the day ye heard of it, and knew the
grac of god in truth:
1:7  As ye also learn of epaphra our dear fellowservant, who is for you
a faith minist of christ;
1:8  who also declar unto us your love in the spirit.

1:9  for thi caus we also, sinc the day we heard it, do not ceas to
pray for you, and to desir that ye might be fill with the knowledg of his
wil in all wisdom and spiritu understanding;
1:10  that ye might walk worthi of the lord unto all pleasing, being
fruit in everi good work, and increas in the knowledg of god;
1:11  strengthen with all might, accord to hi gloriou power, unto
al patienc and longsuff with joyfulness;
1:12  give thank unto the father, which hath made us meet to be
partak of the inherit of the saint in light:
1:13  who hath deliv us from the power of darkness, and hath translated
u into the kingdom of hi dear son:
1:14  In whom we have redempt through hi blood, even the forgiv of
sins:
1:15  who is the imag of the invis god, the firstborn of every
creature:
1:16  for by him were all thing created, that are in heaven, and that are
in earth, visibl and invisible, whether they be thrones, or dominions, or
principalities, or powers: all thing were creat by him, and for him:
1:17  and he is befor all things, and by him all thing consist.

1:18  and he is the head of the body, the church: who is the beginning, the
firstborn from the dead; that in all thing he might have the preeminence.

1:19  for it pleas the father that in him should all ful dwell;
1:20  and, have made peac through the blood of hi cross, by him to
reconcil all thing unto himself; by him, I say, whether they be thing in
earth, or thing in heaven.

1:21  and you, that were sometim alien and enemi in your mind by
wick works, yet now hath he reconciled
1:22  In the bodi of hi flesh through death, to present you holi and
unblam and unreprov in hi sight:
1:23  If ye continu in the faith ground and settled, and be not moved
away from the hope of the gospel, which ye have heard, and which wa preached
to everi creatur which is under heaven; whereof I paul am made a minister;
1:24  who now rejoic in my suffer for you, and fill up that which is
behind of the afflict of christ in my flesh for hi body' sake, which is
th church:
1:25  whereof I am made a minister, accord to the dispens of god
which is given to me for you, to fulfil the word of god;
1:26  even the mysteri which hath been hid from age and from generations,
but now is made manifest to hi saints:
1:27  To whom god would make known what is the rich of the glori of this
mysteri among the gentiles; which is christ in you, the hope of glory:
1:28  whom we preach, warn everi man, and teach everi man in all
wisdom; that we may present everi man perfect in christ jesus:
1:29  whereunto I also labour, strive accord to hi working, which
worketh in me mightily.

2:1  for I would that ye knew what great conflict I have for you, and for
them at laodicea, and for as mani as have not seen my face in the flesh;
2:2  that their heart might be comforted, be knit togeth in love, and
unto all rich of the full assur of understanding, to the
acknowledg of the mysteri of god, and of the father, and of christ;
2:3  In whom are hid all the treasur of wisdom and knowledge.

2:4  and thi I say, lest ani man should beguil you with entic words.

2:5  for though I be absent in the flesh, yet am I with you in the spirit,
joy and behold your order, and the stedfast of your faith in
christ.

2:6  As ye have therefor receiv christ jesu the lord, so walk ye in
him:
2:7  root and built up in him, and stablish in the faith, as ye have
been taught, abound therein with thanksgiving.

2:8  bewar lest ani man spoil you through philosophi and vain deceit,
aft the tradit of men, after the rudiment of the world, and not after
christ.

2:9  for in him dwelleth all the ful of the godhead bodily.

2:10  and ye are complet in him, which is the head of all princip and
power:
2:11  In whom also ye are circumcis with the circumcis made without
hands, in put off the bodi of the sin of the flesh by the circumcision
of christ:
2:12  buri with him in baptism, wherein also ye are risen with him
through the faith of the oper of god, who hath rais him from the dead.

2:13  and you, be dead in your sin and the uncircumcis of your
flesh, hath he quicken togeth with him, have forgiven you all
trespasses;
2:14  blot out the handwrit of ordin that wa against us, which
wa contrari to us, and took it out of the way, nail it to hi cross;
2:15  and have spoil princip and powers, he made a shew of them
openly, triumph over them in it.

2:16  let no man therefor judg you in meat, or in drink, or in respect of
an holyday, or of the new moon, or of the sabbath days:
2:17  which are a shadow of thing to come; but the bodi is of christ.

2:18  let no man beguil you of your reward in a voluntari humil and
worship of angels, intrud into those thing which he hath not seen,
vainli puf up by hi fleshli mind,
2:19  and not hold the head, from which all the bodi by joint and bands
hav nourish ministered, and knit together, increaseth with the
increas of god.

2:20  wherefor if ye be dead with christ from the rudiment of the world,
why, as though live in the world, are ye subject to ordinances,
2:21  (touch not; tast not; handl not;
2:22  which all are to perish with the using;) after the command and
doctrin of men?
2:23  which thing have inde a shew of wisdom in will worship, and
humility, and neglect of the body: not in ani honour to the satisfying
of the flesh.

3:1  If ye then be risen with christ, seek those thing which are above,
wher christ sitteth on the right hand of god.

3:2  set your affect on thing above, not on thing on the earth.

3:3  for ye are dead, and your life is hid with christ in god.

3:4  when christ, who is our life, shall appear, then shall ye also appear
with him in glory.

3:5  mortifi therefor your member which are upon the earth; fornication,
uncleanness, inordin affection, evil concupiscence, and covetousness,
which is idolatry:
3:6  for which things' sake the wrath of god cometh on the children of
disobedience:
3:7  In the which ye also walk some time, when ye live in them.

3:8  but now ye also put off all these; anger, wrath, malice, blasphemy,
filthi commun out of your mouth.

3:9  lie not one to another, see that ye have put off the old man with
hi deeds;
3:10  and have put on the new man, which is renew in knowledg after the
imag of him that creat him:
3:11  where there is neither greek nor jew, circumcis nor
uncircumcision, barbarian, scythian, bond nor free: but christ is all, and in
all.

3:12  put on therefore, as the elect of god, holi and beloved, bowel of
mercies, kindness, humbl of mind, meekness, longsuffering;
3:13  forbear one another, and forgiv one another, if ani man have a
quarrel against any: even as christ forgav you, so also do ye.

3:14  and abov all these thing put on charity, which is the bond of
perfectness.

3:15  and let the peac of god rule in your hearts, to the which also ye
ar call in one body; and be ye thankful.

3:16  let the word of christ dwell in you richli in all wisdom; teaching
and admonish one anoth in psalm and hymn and spiritu songs, singing
with grace in your heart to the lord.

3:17  and whatsoev ye do in word or deed, do all in the name of the lord
jesus, give thank to god and the father by him.

3:18  wives, submit yourselv unto your own husbands, as it is fit in the
lord.

3:19  husbands, love your wives, and be not bitter against them.

3:20  children, obey your parent in all things: for thi is well pleasing
unto the lord.

3:21  fathers, provok not your children to anger, lest they be
discouraged.

3:22  servants, obey in all thing your master accord to the flesh; not
with eyeservice, as menpleasers; but in singl of heart, fear god;
3:23  and whatsoev ye do, do it heartily, as to the lord, and not unto
men;
3:24  know that of the lord ye shall receiv the reward of the
inheritance: for ye serv the lord christ.

3:25  but he that doeth wrong shall receiv for the wrong which he hath
done: and there is no respect of persons.

4:1  masters, give unto your servant that which is just and equal; knowing
that ye also have a master in heaven.

4:2  continu in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;
4:3  withal pray also for us, that god would open unto us a door of
utterance, to speak the mysteri of christ, for which I am also in bonds:
4:4  that I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.

4:5  walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeem the time.

4:6  let your speech be alway with grace, season with salt, that ye may
know how ye ought to answer everi man.

4:7  all my state shall tychicu declar unto you, who is a beloved
brother, and a faith minist and fellowserv in the lord:
4:8  whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know
your estate, and comfort your hearts;
4:9  with onesimus, a faith and belov brother, who is one of you. they
shal make known unto you all thing which are done here.

4:10  aristarchu my fellowprison saluteth you, and marcus, sister' son
to barnabas, (touch whom ye receiv commandments: if he come unto you,
rec him;)
4:11  and jesus, which is call justus, who are of the circumcision. these
onli are my fellowwork unto the kingdom of god, which have been a comfort
unto me.

4:12  epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of christ, saluteth you,
alway labour fervent for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and
complet in all the will of god.

4:13  for I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them
that are in laodicea, and them in hierapolis.

4:14  luke, the belov physician, and demas, greet you.

4:15  salut the brethren which are in laodicea, and nymphas, and the
church which is in hi house.

4:16  and when thi epistl is read among you, caus that it be read also
in the church of the laodiceans; and that ye likewis read the epistl from
laodicea.

4:17  and say to archippus, take heed to the ministri which thou hast
receiv in the lord, that thou fulfil it.

4:18  the salut by the hand of me paul. rememb my bonds. grace be
with you. amen.




th first epistl of paul the apostl to the thessalonians


1:1 paul, and silvanus, and timotheus, unto the church of the
thessalonian which is in god the father and in the lord jesu christ:
grac be unto you, and peace, from god our father, and the lord jesus
christ.

1:2 We give thank to god alway for you all, make mention of you in
our prayers; 1:3 rememb without ceas your work of faith, and
labour of love, and patienc of hope in our lord jesu christ, in the
sight of god and our father; 1:4 knowing, brethren beloved, your
elect of god.

1:5 for our gospel came not unto you in word only, but also in power,
and in the holi ghost, and in much assurance; as ye know what manner
of men we were among you for your sake.

1:6 and ye becam follow of us, and of the lord, have received
th word in much affliction, with joy of the holi ghost.

1:7 So that ye were ensampl to all that believ in macedonia and
achaia.

1:8 for from you sound out the word of the lord not onli in
macedonia and achaia, but also in everi place your faith to god-ward
i spread abroad; so that we need not to speak ani thing.

1:9 for they themselv shew of us what manner of enter in we had
unto you, and how ye turn to god from idol to serv the live and
tru god; 1:10 and to wait for hi son from heaven, whom he raised
from the dead, even jesus, which deliv us from the wrath to come.

2:1 for yourselves, brethren, know our entranc in unto you, that it
wa not in vain: 2:2 but even after that we had suffer before, and
wer shame entreated, as ye know, at philippi, we were bold in
our god to speak unto you the gospel of god with much contention.

2:3 for our exhort wa not of deceit, nor of uncleanness, nor in
guile: 2:4 but as we were allow of god to be put in trust with the
gospel, even so we speak; not as pleas men, but god, which trieth
our hearts.

2:5 for neither at ani time use we flatter words, as ye know, nor
a cloke of covetousness; god is witness: 2:6 nor of men sought we
glory, neither of you, nor yet of others, when we might have been
burdensome, as the apostl of christ.

2:7 but we were gentl among you, even as a nurs cherisheth her
children: 2:8 So be affection desir of you, we were willing
to have impart unto you, not the gospel of god only, but also our
own souls, becaus ye were dear unto us.

2:9 for ye remember, brethren, our labour and travail: for labouring
night and day, becaus we would not be chargeabl unto ani of you, we
preach unto you the gospel of god.

2:10 Ye are witnesses, and god also, how holili and justli and
unblam we behav ourselv among you that believe: 2:11 As ye
know how we exhort and comfort and charg everi one of you, as a
fath doth hi children, 2:12 that ye would walk worthi of god, who
hath call you unto hi kingdom and glory.

2:13 for thi caus also thank we god without ceasing, because, when
y receiv the word of god which ye heard of us, ye receiv it not
a the word of men, but as it is in truth, the word of god, which
effectu worketh also in you that believe.

2:14 for ye, brethren, becam follow of the church of god which
in judaea are in christ jesus: for ye also have suffer like things
of your own countrymen, even as they have of the jews: 2:15 who both
kil the lord jesus, and their own prophets, and have persecut us;
and they pleas not god, and are contrari to all men: 2:16 forbidding
u to speak to the gentil that they might be saved, to fill up their
sin alway: for the wrath is come upon them to the uttermost.

2:17 but we, brethren, be taken from you for a short time in
presence, not in heart, endeavour the more abundantli to see your
fac with great desire.

2:18 wherefor we would have come unto you, even I paul, onc and
again; but satan hinder us.

2:19 for what is our hope, or joy, or crown of rejoicing? are not even
y in the presenc of our lord jesu christ at hi coming?  2:20 for
y are our glori and joy.

3:1 wherefor when we could no longer forbear, we thought it good to
b left at athen alone; 3:2 and sent timotheus, our brother, and
minist of god, and our fellowlabour in the gospel of christ, to
establish you, and to comfort you concern your faith: 3:3 that no
man should be move by these afflictions: for yourselv know that we
ar appoint thereunto.

3:4 for verily, when we were with you, we told you befor that we
should suffer tribulation; even as it came to pass, and ye know.

3:5 for thi cause, when I could no longer forbear, I sent to know
your faith, lest by some mean the tempter have tempt you, and our
labour be in vain.

3:6 but now when timotheu came from you unto us, and brought us good
tid of your faith and charity, and that ye have good remembrance
of us always, desir greatli to see us, as we also to see you: 3:7
therefore, brethren, we were comfort over you in all our affliction
and distress by your faith: 3:8 for now we live, if ye stand fast in
th lord.

3:9 for what thank can we render to god again for you, for all the
joy wherewith we joy for your sake befor our god; 3:10 night and day
pray exceedingli that we might see your face, and might perfect
that which is lack in your faith?  3:11 now god himself and our
father, and our lord jesu christ, direct our way unto you.

3:12 and the lord make you to increas and abound in love one toward
another, and toward all men, even as we do toward you: 3:13 To the end
h may stablish your heart unblam in holi befor god, even
our father, at the come of our lord jesu christ with all his
saints.

4:1 furthermor then we beseech you, brethren, and exhort you by the
lord jesus, that as ye have receiv of us how ye ought to walk and to
pleas god, so ye would abound more and more.

4:2 for ye know what command we gave you by the lord jesus.

4:3 for thi is the will of god, even your sanctification, that ye
should abstain from fornication: 4:4 that everi one of you should know
how to possess hi vessel in sanctif and honour; 4:5 not in the
lust of concupiscence, even as the gentil which know not god: 4:6
that no man go beyond and defraud hi brother in ani matter: because
that the lord is the aveng of all such, as we also have forewarned
y and testified.

4:7 for god hath not call us unto uncleanness, but unto holiness.

4:8 He therefor that despiseth, despiseth not man, but god, who hath
also given unto us hi holi spirit.
