4:9 but as touch brotherli love ye need not that I write unto you:
for ye yourselv are taught of god to love one another.

4:10 and inde ye do it toward all the brethren which are in all
macedonia: but we beseech you, brethren, that ye increas more and
more; 4:11 and that ye studi to be quiet, and to do your own business,
and to work with your own hands, as we command you; 4:12 that ye may
walk honestli toward them that are without, and that ye may have lack
of nothing.

4:13 but I would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning
them which are asleep, that ye sorrow not, even as other which have
no hope.

4:14 for if we believ that jesu die and rose again, even so them
also which sleep in jesu will god bring with him.

4:15 for thi we say unto you by the word of the lord, that we which
ar aliv and remain unto the come of the lord shall not prevent
them which are asleep.

4:16 for the lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with
th voic of the archangel, and with the trump of god: and the dead in
christ shall rise first: 4:17 then we which are aliv and remain shall
b caught up togeth with them in the clouds, to meet the lord in the
air: and so shall we ever be with the lord.

4:18 wherefor comfort one anoth with these words.

5:1 but of the time and the seasons, brethren, ye have no need that i
writ unto you.

5:2 for yourselv know perfectli that the day of the lord so cometh
a a thief in the night.

5:3 for when they shall say, peac and safety; then sudden destruction
cometh upon them, as travail upon a woman with child; and they shall
not escape.

5:4 but ye, brethren, are not in darkness, that that day should
overtak you as a thief.

5:5 Ye are all the children of light, and the children of the day: we
ar not of the night, nor of darkness.

5:6 therefor let us not sleep, as do others; but let us watch and be
sober.

5:7 for they that sleep sleep in the night; and they that be drunken
ar drunken in the night.

5:8 but let us, who are of the day, be sober, put on the
breastpl of faith and love; and for an helmet, the hope of
salvation.

5:9 for god hath not appoint us to wrath, but to obtain salvat by
our lord jesu christ, 5:10 who die for us, that, whether we wake or
sleep, we should live togeth with him.

5:11 wherefor comfort yourselv together, and edifi one another,
even as also ye do.

5:12 and we beseech you, brethren, to know them which labour among
you, and are over you in the lord, and admonish you; 5:13 and to
esteem them veri highli in love for their work' sake. and be at peace
among yourselves.

5:14 now we exhort you, brethren, warn them that are unruly, comfort
th feebleminded, support the weak, be patient toward all men.

5:15 see that none render evil for evil unto ani man; but ever follow
that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.

5:16 rejoic evermore.

5:17 pray without ceasing.

5:18 In everi thing give thanks: for thi is the will of god in christ
jesu concern you.

5:19 quench not the spirit.

5:20 despis not prophesyings.

5:21 prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

5:22 abstain from all appear of evil.

5:23 and the veri god of peac sanctifi you wholly; and I pray god
your whole spirit and soul and bodi be preserv blameless unto the
com of our lord jesu christ.

5:24 faith is he that calleth you, who also will do it.

5:25 brethren, pray for us.

5:26 greet all the brethren with an holi kiss.

5:27 I charg you by the lord that thi epistl be read unto all the
holi brethren.

5:28 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you. amen.




th second epistl of paul the apostl to the thessalonians


1:1 paul, and silvanus, and timotheus, unto the church of the
thessalonian in god our father and the lord jesu christ: 1:2 grace
unto you, and peace, from god our father and the lord jesu christ.

1:3 We are bound to thank god alway for you, brethren, as it is meet,
becaus that your faith groweth exceedingly, and the chariti of every
on of you all toward each other aboundeth; 1:4 So that we ourselves
glori in you in the church of god for your patienc and faith in all
your persecut and tribul that ye endure: 1:5 which is a
manifest token of the righteou judgment of god, that ye may be
count worthi of the kingdom of god, for which ye also suffer: 1:6
see it is a righteou thing with god to recompens tribul to
them that troubl you; 1:7 and to you who are troubl rest with us,
when the lord jesu shall be reveal from heaven with hi mighty
angels, 1:8 In flame fire take vengeanc on them that know not
god, and that obey not the gospel of our lord jesu christ: 1:9 who
shal be punish with everlast destruct from the presenc of
th lord, and from the glori of hi power; 1:10 when he shall come to
b glorifi in hi saints, and to be admir in all them that believe
(becaus our testimoni among you wa believed) in that day.

1:11 wherefor also we pray alway for you, that our god would count
you worthi of thi calling, and fulfil all the good pleasur of his
goodness, and the work of faith with power: 1:12 that the name of our
lord jesu christ may be glorifi in you, and ye in him, accord to
th grace of our god and the lord jesu christ.

2:1 now we beseech you, brethren, by the come of our lord jesus
christ, and by our gather togeth unto him, 2:2 that ye be not
soon shaken in mind, or be troubled, neither by spirit, nor by word,
nor by letter as from us, as that the day of christ is at hand.

2:3 let no man deceiv you by ani means: for that day shall not come,
except there come a fall away first, and that man of sin be
revealed, the son of perdition; 2:4 who opposeth and exalteth himself
abov all that is call god, or that is worshipped; so that he as god
sitteth in the templ of god, shew himself that he is god.

2:5 rememb ye not, that, when I wa yet with you, I told you these
things?  2:6 and now ye know what withholdeth that he might be
rev in hi time.

2:7 for the mysteri of iniqu doth alreadi work: onli he who now
letteth will let, until he be taken out of the way.

2:8 and then shall that wick be revealed, whom the lord shall
consum with the spirit of hi mouth, and shall destroy with the
bright of hi coming: 2:9 even him, whose come is after the
work of satan with all power and sign and lie wonders, 2:10 and
with all deceiv of unright in them that perish;
becaus they receiv not the love of the truth, that they might be
saved.

2:11 and for thi caus god shall send them strong delusion, that they
should believ a lie: 2:12 that they all might be damn who believed
not the truth, but had pleasur in unrighteousness.

2:13 but we are bound to give thank alway to god for you, brethren
belov of the lord, becaus god hath from the begin chosen you to
salv through sanctif of the spirit and belief of the
truth: 2:14 whereunto he call you by our gospel, to the obtain of
th glori of our lord jesu christ.

2:15 therefore, brethren, stand fast, and hold the tradit which ye
hav been taught, whether by word, or our epistle.

2:16 now our lord jesu christ himself, and god, even our father,
which hath love us, and hath given us everlast consol and
good hope through grace, 2:17 comfort your hearts, and stablish you in
everi good word and work.

3:1 finally, brethren, pray for us, that the word of the lord may have
fre course, and be glorified, even as it is with you: 3:2 and that we
may be deliv from unreason and wick men: for all men have
not faith.

3:3 but the lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you
from evil.

3:4 and we have confid in the lord touch you, that ye both do
and will do the thing which we command you.

3:5 and the lord direct your heart into the love of god, and into the
pati wait for christ.

3:6 now we command you, brethren, in the name of our lord jesus
christ, that ye withdraw yourselv from everi brother that walketh
disorderly, and not after the tradit which he receiv of us.

3:7 for yourselv know how ye ought to follow us: for we behav not
ourselv disorderli among you; 3:8 neither did we eat ani man' bread
for nought; but wrought with labour and travail night and day, that we
might not be chargeabl to ani of you: 3:9 not becaus we have not
power, but to make ourselv an ensampl unto you to follow us.

3:10 for even when we were with you, thi we command you, that if
ani would not work, neither should he eat.

3:11 for we hear that there are some which walk among you disorderly,
work not at all, but are busybodies.

3:12 now them that are such we command and exhort by our lord jesus
christ, that with quiet they work, and eat their own bread.

3:13 but ye, brethren, be not weari in well doing.

3:14 and if ani man obey not our word by thi epistle, note that man,
and have no compani with him, that he may be ashamed.

3:15 yet count him not as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.

3:16 now the lord of peac himself give you peac alway by all means.
th lord be with you all.

3:17 the salut of paul with mine own hand, which is the token in
everi epistle: so I write.

3:18 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all. amen.




th first epistl of paul the apostl to timothy


1:1 paul, an apostl of jesu christ by the command of god our
saviour, and lord jesu christ, which is our hope; 1:2 unto timothy,
mi own son in the faith: grace, mercy, and peace, from god our father
and jesu christ our lord.

1:3 As I besought thee to abid still at ephesus, when I went into
macedonia, that thou mightest charg some that they teach no other
doctrine, 1:4 neither give heed to fabl and endless genealogies,
which minist questions, rather than godli edifi which is in
faith: so do.

1:5 now the end of the command is chariti out of a pure heart, and
of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned: 1:6 from which some
hav swerv have turn asid unto vain jangling; 1:7 desir to
b teacher of the law; understand neither what they say, nor
whereof they affirm.

1:8 but we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully; 1:9
know this, that the law is not made for a righteou man, but for
th lawless and disobedient, for the ungodli and for sinners, for
unholi and profane, for murder of father and murder of mothers,
for manslayers, 1:10 for whoremongers, for them that defil themselves
with mankind, for menstealers, for liars, for perjur persons, and if
ther be ani other thing that is contrari to sound doctrine; 1:11
accord to the gloriou gospel of the bless god, which was
commit to my trust.

1:12 and I thank christ jesu our lord, who hath enabl me, for that
h count me faithful, put me into the ministry; 1:13 who was
befor a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: but I obtained
mercy, becaus I did it ignorantli in unbelief.

1:14 and the grace of our lord wa exceed abund with faith and
lov which is in christ jesus.

1:15 thi is a faith saying, and worthi of all acceptation, that
christ jesu came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief.

1:16 howbeit for thi caus I obtain mercy, that in me first jesus
christ might shew forth all longsuffering, for a pattern to them which
should hereaft believ on him to life everlasting.

1:17 now unto the king eternal, immortal, invisible, the onli wise
god, be honour and glori for ever and ever. amen.

1:18 thi charg I commit unto thee, son timothy, accord to the
propheci which went befor on thee, that thou by them mightest war a
good warfare; 1:19 hold faith, and a good conscience; which some
hav put away concern faith have made shipwreck: 1:20 Of whom is
hymenaeu and alexander; whom I have deliv unto satan, that they
may learn not to blaspheme.

2:1 I exhort therefore, that, first of all, supplications, prayers,
intercessions, and give of thanks, be made for all men; 2:2 for
kings, and for all that are in authority; that we may lead a quiet and
peac life in all godli and honesty.

2:3 for thi is good and accept in the sight of god our saviour;
2:4 who will have all men to be saved, and to come unto the knowledge
of the truth.

2:5 for there is one god, and one mediat between god and men, the
man christ jesus; 2:6 who gave himself a ransom for all, to be
testifi in due time.

2:7 whereunto I am ordain a preacher, and an apostle, (I speak the
truth in christ, and lie not;) a teacher of the gentil in faith and
verity.

2:8 I will therefor that men pray everi where, lift up holi hands,
without wrath and doubting.

2:9 In like manner also, that women adorn themselv in modest
apparel, with shamefaced and sobriety; not with broid hair, or
gold, or pearls, or costli array; 2:10 but (which becometh women
profess godliness) with good works.

2:11 let the woman learn in silenc with all subjection.

2:12 but I suffer not a woman to teach, nor to usurp author over
th man, but to be in silence.

2:13 for adam wa first formed, then eve.

2:14 and adam wa not deceived, but the woman be deceiv wa in
th transgression.

2:15 notwithstand she shall be save in childbearing, if they
continu in faith and chariti and holi with sobriety.

3:1 thi is a true saying, If a man desir the offic of a bishop, he
desireth a good work.

3:2 A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife,
vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to
teach; 3:3 not given to wine, no striker, not greedi of filthi lucre;
but patient, not a brawler, not covetous; 3:4 one that ruleth well his
own house, have hi children in subject with all gravity; 3:5
(for if a man know not how to rule hi own house, how shall he take
car of the church of god?)  3:6 not a novice, lest be lift up
with pride he fall into the condemn of the devil.

3:7 moreov he must have a good report of them which are without;
lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

3:8 likewis must the deacon be grave, not doubletongued, not given
to much wine, not greedi of filthi lucre; 3:9 hold the mysteri of
th faith in a pure conscience.

3:10 and let these also first be proved; then let them use the office
of a deacon, be found blameless.

3:11 even so must their wive be grave, not slanderers, sober,
faith in all things.

3:12 let the deacon be the husband of one wife, rule their
children and their own hous well.

3:13 for they that have use the offic of a deacon well purchas to
themselv a good degree, and great bold in the faith which is in
christ jesus.

3:14 these thing write I unto thee, hope to come unto thee shortly:
3:15 but if I tarri long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to
behav thyself in the hous of god, which is the church of the living
god, the pillar and ground of the truth.

3:16 and without controversi great is the mysteri of godliness: god
wa manifest in the flesh, justifi in the spirit, seen of angels,
preach unto the gentiles, believ on in the world, receiv up into
glory.

4:1 now the spirit speaketh expressly, that in the latter time some
shal depart from the faith, give heed to seduc spirits, and
doctrin of devils; 4:2 speak lie in hypocrisy; have their
consci sear with a hot iron; 4:3 forbid to marry, and
command to abstain from meats, which god hath creat to be
receiv with thanksgiv of them which believ and know the truth.

4:4 for everi creatur of god is good, and noth to be refused, if
it be receiv with thanksgiving: 4:5 for it is sanctifi by the word
of god and prayer.

4:6 If thou put the brethren in remembr of these things, thou
shalt be a good minist of jesu christ, nourish up in the word of
faith and of good doctrine, whereunto thou hast attained.

4:7 but refus profan and old wives' fables, and exercis thyself
rath unto godliness.

4:8 for bodili exercis profiteth little: but godli is profitable
unto all things, have promis of the life that now is, and of that
which is to come.

4:9 thi is a faith say and worthi of all acceptation.

4:10 for therefor we both labour and suffer reproach, becaus we
trust in the live god, who is the saviour of all men, special of
thos that believe.

4:11 these thing command and teach.

4:12 let no man despis thi youth; but be thou an exampl of the
believers, in word, in conversation, in charity, in spirit, in faith,
in purity.

4:13 till I come, give attend to reading, to exhortation, to
doctrine.

4:14 neglect not the gift that is in thee, which wa given thee by
prophecy, with the lay on of the hand of the presbytery.

4:15 medit upon these things; give thyself wholli to them; that thy
profit may appear to all.

4:16 take heed unto thyself, and unto the doctrine; continu in them:
for in do thi thou shalt both save thyself, and them that hear
thee.

5:1 rebuk not an elder, but intreat him as a father; and the younger
men as brethren; 5:2 the elder women as mothers; the younger as
sisters, with all purity.

5:3 honour widow that are widow indeed.

5:4 but if ani widow have children or nephews, let them learn first to
shew pieti at home, and to requit their parents: for that is good and
accept befor god.

5:5 now she that is a widow indeed, and desolate, trusteth in god, and
continueth in supplic and prayer night and day.

5:6 but she that liveth in pleasur is dead while she liveth.

5:7 and these thing give in charge, that they may be blameless.

5:8 but if ani provid not for hi own, and special for those of his
own house, he hath deni the faith, and is wors than an infidel.

5:9 let not a widow be taken into the number under threescor years
old, have been the wife of one man.

5:10 well report of for good works; if she have brought up children,
if she have lodg strangers, if she have wash the saints' feet, if
sh have reliev the afflicted, if she have dilig follow every
good work.

5:11 but the younger widow refuse: for when they have begun to wax
wanton against christ, they will marry; 5:12 have damnation, because
they have cast off their first faith.

5:13 and withal they learn to be idle, wander about from hous to
house; and not onli idle, but tattler also and busybodies, speaking
th which they ought not.

5:14 I will therefor that the younger women marry, bear children,
guid the house, give none occas to the adversari to speak
reproachfully.

5:15 for some are alreadi turn asid after satan.

5:16 If ani man or woman that believeth have widows, let them relieve
them, and let not the church be charged; that it may reliev them that
ar widow indeed.

5:17 let the elder that rule well be count worthi of doubl honour,
especi they who labour in the word and doctrine.

5:18 for the scriptur saith, thou shalt not muzzl the ox that
treadeth out the corn. and, the labour is worthi of hi reward.

5:19 against an elder receiv not an accusation, but befor two or
thre witnesses.

5:20 them that sin rebuk befor all, that other also may fear.

5:21 I charg thee befor god, and the lord jesu christ, and the
elect angels, that thou observ these thing without prefer one
befor another, do noth by partiality.

5:22 lay hand suddenli on no man, neither be partak of other men's
sins: keep thyself pure.

5:23 drink no longer water, but use a littl wine for thi stomach's
sak and thine often infirmities.

5:24 some men' sin are open beforehand, go befor to judgment;
and some men they follow after.

5:25 likewis also the good work of some are manifest beforehand; and
they that are otherwis cannot be hid.

6:1 let as mani servant as are under the yoke count their own masters
worthi of all honour, that the name of god and hi doctrin be not
blasphemed.

6:2 and they that have believ masters, let them not despis them,
becaus they are brethren; but rather do them service, becaus they
ar faith and beloved, partak of the benefit. these thing teach
and exhort.

6:3 If ani man teach otherwise, and consent not to wholesom words,
even the word of our lord jesu christ, and to the doctrin which is
accord to godliness; 6:4 He is proud, know nothing, but doting
about question and strife of words, whereof cometh envy, strife,
railings, evil surmisings, 6:5 pervers disput of men of corrupt
minds, and destitut of the truth, suppos that gain is godliness:
from such withdraw thyself.

6:6 but godli with content is great gain.

6:7 for we brought noth into thi world, and it is certain we can
carri noth out.

6:8 and have food and raiment let us be therewith content.

6:9 but they that will be rich fall into temptat and a snare, and
into mani foolish and hurt lusts, which drown men in destruction
and perdition.

6:10 for the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some
covet after, they have er from the faith, and pierc themselves
through with mani sorrows.

6:11 but thou, O man of god, flee these things; and follow after
righteousness, godliness, faith, love, patience, meekness.

6:12 fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on etern life,
whereunto thou art also called, and hast profess a good profession
befor mani witnesses.

6:13 I give thee charg in the sight of god, who quickeneth all
things, and befor christ jesus, who befor pontiu pilat wit a
good confession; 6:14 that thou keep thi command without spot,
unrebukable, until the appear of our lord jesu christ: 6:15 which
in hi time he shall shew, who is the bless and onli potentate, the
k of kings, and lord of lords; 6:16 who onli hath immortality,
dwel in the light which no man can approach unto; whom no man hath
seen, nor can see: to whom be honour and power everlasting. amen.

6:17 charg them that are rich in thi world, that they be not
highminded, nor trust in uncertain riches, but in the live god, who
giveth us richli all thing to enjoy; 6:18 that they do good, that
they be rich in good works, readi to distribute, will to
communicate; 6:19 lay up in store for themselv a good foundation
against the time to come, that they may lay hold on etern life.

6:20 O timothy, keep that which is commit to thi trust, avoiding
profan and vain babblings, and opposit of scienc fals so
called: 6:21 which some profess have er concern the faith.
grac be with thee. amen.




th second epistl of paul the apostl to timothy


1:1 paul, an apostl of jesu christ by the will of god, accord to
th promis of life which is in christ jesus, 1:2 To timothy,
mi dearli belov son: grace, mercy, and peace, from god the father
and christ jesu our lord.

1:3 I thank god, whom I serv from my forefath with pure
conscience, that without ceas I have remembr of thee in my
pray night and day; 1:4 greatli desir to see thee, be mindful
of thi tears, that I may be fill with joy; 1:5 when I call to
remembr the unfeign faith that is in thee, which dwelt first in
thi grandmoth lois, and thi mother eunice; and I am persuad that
in thee also.

1:6 wherefor I put thee in remembr that thou stir up the gift of
god, which is in thee by the put on of my hands.

1:7 for god hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of
love, and of a sound mind.

1:8 Be not thou therefor asham of the testimoni of our lord, nor of
m hi prisoner: but be thou partak of the afflict of the gospel
accord to the power of god; 1:9 who hath save us, and call us
with an holi calling, not accord to our works, but accord to his
own purpos and grace, which wa given us in christ jesu befor the
world began, 1:10 but is now made manifest by the appear of our
saviour jesu christ, who hath abolish death, and hath brought life
and immort to light through the gospel: 1:11 whereunto I am
appoint a preacher, and an apostle, and a teacher of the gentiles.

1:12 for the which caus I also suffer these things: nevertheless I am
not ashamed: for I know whom I have believed, and am persuad that he
i abl to keep that which I have commit unto him against that day.

1:13 hold fast the form of sound words, which thou hast heard of me,
in faith and love which is in christ jesus.

1:14 that good thing which wa commit unto thee keep by the holy
ghost which dwelleth in us.

1:15 thi thou knowest, that all they which are in asia be turn away
from me; of whom are phygellu and hermogenes.

1:16 the lord give merci unto the hous of onesiphorus; for he oft
refresh me, and wa not asham of my chain: 1:17 but, when he was
in rome, he sought me out veri diligently, and found me.

1:18 the lord grant unto him that he may find merci of the lord in
that day: and in how mani thing he minist unto me at ephesus,
th knowest veri well.

2:1 thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in christ
jesus.

2:2 and the thing that thou hast heard of me among mani witnesses,
th same commit thou to faith men, who shall be abl to teach
oth also.

2:3 thou therefor endur hardness, as a good soldier of jesu christ.

2:4 No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affair of this
life; that he may pleas him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.

2:5 and if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned,
except he strive lawfully.

2:6 the husbandman that laboureth must be first partak of the
fruits.

2:7 consid what I say; and the lord give thee understand in all
things.

2:8 rememb that jesu christ of the seed of david wa rais from
th dead accord to my gospel: 2:9 wherein I suffer trouble, as an
evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of god is not bound.

2:10 therefor I endur all thing for the elect' sakes, that they
may also obtain the salvat which is in christ jesu with eternal
glory.

2:11 It is a faith saying: for if we be dead with him, we shall
also live with him: 2:12 If we suffer, we shall also reign with him:
if we deni him, he also will deni us: 2:13 If we believ not, yet he
abideth faithful: he cannot deni himself.

2:14 Of these thing put them in remembrance, charg them befor the
lord that they strive not about word to no profit, but to the
subvert of the hearers.

2:15 studi to shew thyself approv unto god, a workman that needeth
not to be ashamed, rightli divid the word of truth.

2:16 but shun profan and vain babblings: for they will increas unto
mor ungodliness.

2:17 and their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is hymenaeus
and philetus; 2:18 who concern the truth have erred, say that
th resurrect is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

2:19 nevertheless the foundat of god standeth sure, have this
seal, the lord knoweth them that are his. and, let everi one that
nameth the name of christ depart from iniquity.

2:20 but in a great hous there are not onli vessel of gold and of
silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to
dishonour.

2:21 If a man therefor purg himself from these, he shall be a vessel
unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master' use, and prepared
unto everi good work.

2:22 flee also youth lusts: but follow righteousness, faith,
charity, peace, with them that call on the lord out of a pure heart.

2:23 but foolish and unlearn question avoid, know that they do
gend strifes.

2:24 and the servant of the lord must not strive; but be gentl unto
al men, apt to teach, patient, 2:25 In meek instruct those
that oppos themselves; if god peradventur will give them repentance
to the acknowledg of the truth; 2:26 and that they may recover
themselv out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captiv by him
at hi will.

3:1 thi know also, that in the last day peril time shall come.

3:2 for men shall be lover of their own selves, covetous, boasters,
proud, blasphemers, disobedi to parents, unthankful, unholy, 3:3
without natur affection, trucebreakers, fals accusers, incontinent,
fierce, despis of those that are good, 3:4 traitors, heady,
highminded, lover of pleasur more than lover of god; 3:5 have a
form of godliness, but deni the power thereof: from such turn away.

3:6 for of thi sort are they which creep into houses, and lead
capt silli women laden with sins, led away with diver lusts, 3:7
ever learning, and never abl to come to the knowledg of the truth.

3:8 now as jann and jambr withstood moses, so do these also resist
th truth: men of corrupt minds, reprob concern the faith.

3:9 but they shall proceed no further: for their folli shall be
manifest unto all men, as their' also was.

3:10 but thou hast fulli known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose,
faith, longsuffering, charity, patience, 3:11 persecutions,
afflictions, which came unto me at antioch, at iconium, at lystra;
what persecut I endured: but out of them all the lord delivered
me.

3:12 yea, and all that will live godli in christ jesu shall suffer
persecution.

3:13 but evil men and seduc shall wax wors and worse, deceiving,
and be deceived.

3:14 but continu thou in the thing which thou hast learn and hast
been assur of, know of whom thou hast learn them; 3:15 and that
from a child thou hast known the holi scriptures, which are abl to
mak thee wise unto salvat through faith which is in christ jesus.

3:16 all scriptur is given by inspir of god, and is profitable
for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruct in
righteousness: 3:17 that the man of god may be perfect, throughly
furnish unto all good works.

4:1 I charg thee therefor befor god, and the lord jesu christ, who
shal judg the quick and the dead at hi appear and hi kingdom;
4:2 preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove,
rebuke, exhort with all longsuff and doctrine.

4:3 for the time will come when they will not endur sound doctrine;
but after their own lust shall they heap to themselv teachers,
hav itch ears; 4:4 and they shall turn away their ear from the
truth, and shall be turn unto fables.

4:5 but watch thou in all things, endur afflictions, do the work of
an evangelist, make full proof of thi ministry.

4:6 for I am now readi to be offered, and the time of my departur is
at hand.

4:7 I have fought a good fight, I have finish my course, I have kept
th faith: 4:8 henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of
righteousness, which the lord, the righteou judge, shall give me at
that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his
appearing.

4:9 Do thi dilig to come shortli unto me: 4:10 for dema hath
forsaken me, have love thi present world, and is depart unto
thessalonica; crescen to galatia, titu unto dalmatia.

4:11 onli luke is with me. take mark, and bring him with thee: for he
i profit to me for the ministry.

4:12 and tychicu have I sent to ephesus.

4:13 the cloke that I left at troa with carpus, when thou comest,
br with thee, and the books, but especi the parchments.

4:14 alexand the coppersmith did me much evil: the lord reward him
accord to hi works: 4:15 Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath
greatli withstood our words.

4:16 At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me:
i pray god that it may not be laid to their charge.

4:17 notwithstand the lord stood with me, and strengthen me; that
bi me the preach might be fulli known, and that all the gentiles
might hear: and I wa deliv out of the mouth of the lion.

4:18 and the lord shall deliv me from everi evil work, and will
preserv me unto hi heavenli kingdom: to whom be glori for ever and
ever. amen.

4:19 salut prisca and aquila, and the household of onesiphorus.

4:20 erastu abod at corinth: but trophimu have I left at miletum
sick.

4:21 Do thi dilig to come befor winter. eubulu greeteth thee,
and pudens, and linus, and claudia, and all the brethren.

4:22 the lord jesu christ be with thi spirit. grace be with you.
amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to titus


1:1 paul, a servant of god, and an apostl of jesu christ, according
to the faith of god' elect, and the acknowledg of the truth which
i after godliness; 1:2 In hope of etern life, which god, that
cannot lie, promis befor the world began; 1:3 but hath in due times
manifest hi word through preaching, which is commit unto me
accord to the command of god our saviour; 1:4 To titus, mine
own son after the common faith: grace, mercy, and peace, from god the
fath and the lord jesu christ our saviour.

1:5 for thi caus left I thee in crete, that thou shouldest set in
ord the thing that are wanting, and ordain elder in everi city, as
i had appoint thee: 1:6 If ani be blameless, the husband of one
wife, have faith children not accus of riot or unruly.

1:7 for a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of god; not
selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given
to filthi lucre; 1:8 but a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men,
sober, just, holy, temperate; 1:9 hold fast the faith word as he
hath been taught, that he may be abl by sound doctrin both to exhort
and to convinc the gainsayers.

1:10 for there are mani unruli and vain talker and deceivers,
speci they of the circumcision: 1:11 whose mouth must be stopped,
who subvert whole houses, teach thing which they ought not, for
filthi lucre' sake.

1:12 one of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, the
cretian are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

1:13 thi wit is true. wherefor rebuk them sharply, that they
may be sound in the faith; 1:14 not give heed to jewish fables, and
command of men, that turn from the truth.

1:15 unto the pure all thing are pure: but unto them that are defiled
and unbeliev is noth pure; but even their mind and conscienc is
defiled.

1:16 they profess that they know god; but in work they deni him,
b abominable, and disobedient, and unto everi good work reprobate.

2:1 but speak thou the thing which becom sound doctrine: 2:2 that
th age men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity,
in patience.

2:3 the age women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh
holiness, not fals accusers, not given to much wine, teacher of good
things; 2:4 that they may teach the young women to be sober, to love
their husbands, to love their children, 2:5 To be discreet, chaste,
keep at home, good, obedi to their own husbands, that the word
of god be not blasphemed.

2:6 young men likewis exhort to be sober minded.

2:7 In all thing shew thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine
shew uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity, 2:8 sound speech, that
cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrari part may be
ashamed, have no evil thing to say of you.

2:9 exhort servant to be obedi unto their own masters, and to
pleas them well in all things; not answer again; 2:10 not
purloining, but shew all good fidelity; that they may adorn the
doctrin of god our saviour in all things.

2:11 for the grace of god that bringeth salvat hath appear to all
men, 2:12 teach us that, deni ungodli and worldli lusts, we
should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in thi present world;
2:13 look for that bless hope, and the gloriou appear of the
great god and our saviour jesu christ; 2:14 who gave himself for us,
that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purifi unto himself a
peculiar people, zealou of good works.

2:15 these thing speak, and exhort, and rebuk with all authority.
let no man despis thee.

3:1 put them in mind to be subject to princip and powers, to
obey magistrates, to be readi to everi good work, 3:2 To speak evil of
no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shew all meek unto all
men.

3:3 for we ourselv also were sometim foolish, disobedient,
deceived, serv diver lust and pleasures, live in malic and
envy, hateful, and hate one another.

3:4 but after that the kind and love of god our saviour toward man
appeared, 3:5 not by work of righteous which we have done, but
accord to hi merci he save us, by the wash of regeneration,
and renew of the holi ghost; 3:6 which he shed on us abundantly
through jesu christ our saviour; 3:7 that be justifi by his
grace, we should be made heir accord to the hope of etern life.

3:8 thi is a faith saying, and these thing I will that thou
affirm constantly, that they which have believ in god might be
car to maintain good works. these thing are good and profitable
unto men.

3:9 but avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and
striv about the law; for they are unprofit and vain.

3:10 A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition
reject; 3:11 know that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth,
b condemn of himself.

3:12 when I shall send artema unto thee, or tychicus, be dilig to
com unto me to nicopolis: for I have determin there to winter.

3:13 bring zena the lawyer and apollo on their journey diligently,
that noth be want unto them.

3:14 and let our' also learn to maintain good work for necessary
uses, that they be not unfruitful.

3:15 all that are with me salut thee. greet them that love us in the
faith. grace be with you all. amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to philemon


1:1 paul, a prison of jesu christ, and timothi our brother, unto
philemon our dearli beloved, and fellowlabourer, 1:2 and to our
belov apphia, and archippu our fellowsoldier, and to the church in
thi house: 1:3 grace to you, and peace, from god our father and the
lord jesu christ.

1:4 I thank my god, make mention of thee alway in my prayers, 1:5
hear of thi love and faith, which thou hast toward the lord jesus,
and toward all saints; 1:6 that the commun of thi faith may
becom effectu by the acknowledg of everi good thing which is in
you in christ jesus.

1:7 for we have great joy and consol in thi love, becaus the
bowel of the saint are refresh by thee, brother.

1:8 wherefore, though I might be much bold in christ to enjoin thee
that which is convenient, 1:9 yet for love' sake I rather beseech
thee, be such an one as paul the aged, and now also a prison of
jesu christ.

1:10 I beseech thee for my son onesimus, whom I have begotten in my
bonds: 1:11 which in time past wa to thee unprofitable, but now
profit to thee and to me: 1:12 whom I have sent again: thou
therefor receiv him, that is, mine own bowels: 1:13 whom I would
hav retain with me, that in thi stead he might have minist unto
m in the bond of the gospel: 1:14 but without thi mind would I do
nothing; that thi benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but
willingly.

1:15 for perhap he therefor depart for a season, that thou
shouldest receiv him for ever; 1:16 not now as a servant, but abov a
servant, a brother beloved, special to me, but how much more unto
thee, both in the flesh, and in the lord?  1:17 If thou count me
therefor a partner, receiv him as myself.

1:18 If he hath wrong thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine
account; 1:19 I paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay
it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own
self besides.

1:20 yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the lord: refresh my
bowel in the lord.

1:21 have confid in thi obedi I wrote unto thee, knowing
that thou wilt also do more than I say.

1:22 but withal prepar me also a lodging: for I trust that through
your prayer I shall be given unto you.

1:23 there salut thee epaphras, my fellowprison in christ jesus;
1:24 marcus, aristarchus, demas, lucas, my fellowlabourers.

1:25 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with your spirit. amen.




th epistl of paul the apostl to the hebrews


1:1 god, who at sundri time and in diver manner spake in time past
unto the father by the prophets, 1:2 hath in these last day spoken
unto us by hi son, whom he hath appoint heir of all things, by whom
also he made the worlds; 1:3 who be the bright of hi glory,
and the express imag of hi person, and uphold all thing by the
word of hi power, when he had by himself purg our sins, sat down on
th right hand of the majesti on high: 1:4 be made so much better
than the angels, as he hath by inherit obtain a more excellent
nam than they.

1:5 for unto which of the angel said he at ani time, thou art my son,
thi day have I begotten thee? and again, I will be to him a father,
and he shall be to me a son?  1:6 and again, when he bringeth in the
firstbegotten into the world, he saith, and let all the angel of god
worship him.

1:7 and of the angel he saith, who maketh hi angel spirits, and his
minist a flame of fire.

1:8 but unto the son he saith, thi throne, O god, is for ever and
ever: a sceptr of righteous is the sceptr of thi kingdom.

1:9 thou hast love righteousness, and hate iniquity; therefor god,
even thi god, hath anoint thee with the oil of glad abov thy
fellows.

1:10 and, thou, lord, in the begin hast laid the foundat of the
earth; and the heaven are the work of thine hands: 1:11 they shall
perish; but thou remainest; and they all shall wax old as doth a
garment; 1:12 and as a vestur shalt thou fold them up, and they shall
b changed: but thou art the same, and thi year shall not fail.

1:13 but to which of the angel said he at ani time, sit on my right
hand, until I make thine enemi thi footstool?  1:14 are they not all
minist spirits, sent forth to minist for them who shall be
heir of salvation?  2:1 therefor we ought to give the more earnest
he to the thing which we have heard, lest at ani time we should let
them slip.

2:2 for if the word spoken by angel wa stedfast, and every
transgress and disobedi receiv a just recomp of reward;
2:3 how shall we escape, if we neglect so great salvation; which at
th first began to be spoken by the lord, and wa confirm unto us by
them that heard him; 2:4 god also bear them witness, both with
sign and wonders, and with diver miracles, and gift of the holy
ghost, accord to hi own will?  2:5 for unto the angel hath he not
put in subject the world to come, whereof we speak.

2:6 but one in a certain place testified, saying, what is man, that
thou art mind of him? or the son of man that thou visitest him?
2:7 thou madest him a littl lower than the angels; thou crownedst him
with glori and honour, and didst set him over the work of thi hands:
2:8 thou hast put all thing in subject under hi feet. for in that
h put all in subject under him, he left noth that is not put
und him.

but now we see not yet all thing put under him.

2:9 but we see jesus, who wa made a littl lower than the angel for
th suffer of death, crown with glori and honour; that he by the
grac of god should tast death for everi man.

2:10 for it becam him, for whom are all things, and by whom are all
things, in bring mani son unto glory, to make the captain of their
salv perfect through sufferings.

2:11 for both he that sanctifieth and they who are sanctifi are all
of one: for which caus he is not asham to call them brethren, 2:12
saying, I will declar thi name unto my brethren, in the midst of the
church will I sing prais unto thee.

2:13 and again, I will put my trust in him. and again, behold I and
th children which god hath given me.

2:14 forasmuch then as the children are partak of flesh and blood,
h also himself likewis took part of the same; that through death he
might destroy him that had the power of death, that is, the devil;
2:15 and deliv them who through fear of death were all their
lifetim subject to bondage.

2:16 for verili he took not on him the natur of angels; but he took
on him the seed of abraham.

2:17 wherefor in all thing it behov him to be made like unto his
brethren, that he might be a merci and faith high priest in
th pertain to god, to make reconcili for the sin of the
people.

2:18 for in that he himself hath suffer be tempted, he is abl to
succour them that are tempted.

3:1 wherefore, holi brethren, partak of the heavenli calling,
consid the apostl and high priest of our profession, christ jesus;
3:2 who wa faith to him that appoint him, as also mose was
faith in all hi house.

3:3 for thi man wa count worthi of more glori than moses, inasmuch
a he who hath build the hous hath more honour than the house.

3:4 for everi hous is build by some man; but he that built all
th is god.

3:5 and mose verili wa faith in all hi house, as a servant, for
a testimoni of those thing which were to be spoken after; 3:6 but
christ as a son over hi own house; whose hous are we, if we hold
fast the confid and the rejoic of the hope firm unto the end.

3:7 wherefor (a the holi ghost saith, To day if ye will hear his
voice, 3:8 harden not your hearts, as in the provocation, in the day
of temptat in the wilderness: 3:9 when your father tempt me,
prov me, and saw my work forti years.

3:10 wherefor I wa griev with that generation, and said, they do
alway err in their heart; and they have not known my ways.

3:11 So I sware in my wrath, they shall not enter into my rest.)  3:12
take heed, brethren, lest there be in ani of you an evil heart of
unbelief, in depart from the live god.

3:13 but exhort one anoth daily, while it is call To day; lest any
of you be harden through the deceit of sin.

3:14 for we are made partak of christ, if we hold the begin of
our confid stedfast unto the end; 3:15 while it is said, To day if
y will hear hi voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

3:16 for some, when they had heard, did provoke: howbeit not all that
cam out of egypt by moses.

3:17 but with whom wa he griev forti years? wa it not with them
that had sinned, whose carcas fell in the wilderness?  3:18 and to
whom sware he that they should not enter into hi rest, but to them
that believ not?  3:19 So we see that they could not enter in
becaus of unbelief.

4:1 let us therefor fear, lest, a promis be left us of entering
into hi rest, ani of you should seem to come short of it.

4:2 for unto us wa the gospel preached, as well as unto them: but the
word preach did not profit them, not be mix with faith in them
that heard it.

4:3 for we which have believ do enter into rest, as he said, As i
hav sworn in my wrath, if they shall enter into my rest: although the
work were finish from the foundat of the world.

4:4 for he spake in a certain place of the seventh day on thi wise,
and god did rest the seventh day from all hi works.

4:5 and in thi place again, If they shall enter into my rest.

4:6 see therefor it remaineth that some must enter therein, and
they to whom it wa first preach enter not in becaus of unbelief:
4:7 again, he limiteth a certain day, say in david, To day, after
so long a time; as it is said, To day if ye will hear hi voice,
harden not your hearts.

4:8 for if jesu had given them rest, then would he not afterward have
spoken of anoth day.

4:9 there remaineth therefor a rest to the peopl of god.

4:10 for he that is enter into hi rest, he also hath ceas from
hi own works, as god did from his.

4:11 let us labour therefor to enter into that rest, lest ani man
fal after the same exampl of unbelief.

4:12 for the word of god is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any
twoedg sword, pierc even to the divid asund of soul and
spirit, and of the joint and marrow, and is a discern of the
thought and intent of the heart.

4:13 neither is there ani creatur that is not manifest in hi sight:
but all thing are nake and open unto the eye of him with whom we
hav to do.

4:14 see then that we have a great high priest, that is pass into
th heavens, jesu the son of god, let us hold fast our profession.

4:15 for we have not an high priest which cannot be touch with the
feel of our infirmities; but wa in all point tempt like as we
are, yet without sin.

4:16 let us therefor come boldli unto the throne of grace, that we
may obtain mercy, and find grace to help in time of need.

5:1 for everi high priest taken from among men is ordain for men in
th pertain to god, that he may offer both gift and sacrifices
for sins: 5:2 who can have compass on the ignorant, and on them
that are out of the way; for that he himself also is compass with
infirmity.

5:3 and by reason hereof he ought, as for the people, so also for
himself, to offer for sins.

5:4 and no man taketh thi honour unto himself, but he that is called
of god, as wa aaron.

5:5 So also christ glorifi not himself to be made an high priest;
but he that said unto him, thou art my son, to day have I begotten
thee.

5:6 As he saith also in anoth place, thou art a priest for ever
aft the order of melchisedec.

5:7 who in the day of hi flesh, when he had offer up prayer and
suppl with strong cri and tear unto him that wa abl to
sav him from death, and wa heard in that he feared; 5:8 though he
wer a son, yet learn he obedi by the thing which he suffered;
5:9 and be made perfect, he becam the author of etern salvation
unto all them that obey him; 5:10 call of god an high priest after
th order of melchisedec.

5:11 Of whom we have mani thing to say, and hard to be uttered,
se ye are dull of hearing.

5:12 for when for the time ye ought to be teachers, ye have need that
on teach you again which be the first principl of the oracl of
god; and are becom such as have need of milk, and not of strong meat.

5:13 for everi one that useth milk is unskil in the word of
righteousness: for he is a babe.

5:14 but strong meat belongeth to them that are of full age, even
thos who by reason of use have their sens exercis to discern both
good and evil.

6:1 therefor leav the principl of the doctrin of christ, let us
go on unto perfection; not lay again the foundat of repentance
from dead works, and of faith toward god, 6:2 Of the doctrin of
baptisms, and of lay on of hands, and of resurrect of the dead,
and of etern judgment.

6:3 and thi will we do, if god permit.

6:4 for it is imposs for those who were onc enlightened, and have
tast of the heavenli gift, and were made partak of the holy
ghost, 6:5 and have tast the good word of god, and the power of the
world to come, 6:6 If they shall fall away, to renew them again unto
repentance; see they crucifi to themselv the son of god afresh,
and put him to an open shame.

6:7 for the earth which drinketh in the rain that cometh oft upon it,
and bringeth forth herb meet for them by whom it is dressed,
receiveth bless from god: 6:8 but that which beareth thorn and
brier is rejected, and is nigh unto cursing; whose end is to be
burned.

6:9 but, beloved, we are persuad better thing of you, and things
that accompani salvation, though we thu speak.

6:10 for god is not unright to forget your work and labour of
love, which ye have shew toward hi name, in that ye have ministered
to the saints, and do minister.

6:11 and we desir that everi one of you do shew the same dilig to
th full assur of hope unto the end: 6:12 that ye be not slothful,
but follow of them who through faith and patienc inherit the
promises.

6:13 for when god made promis to abraham, becaus he could swear by
no greater, he sware by himself, 6:14 saying, sure bless I will
bless thee, and multipli I will multipli thee.

6:15 and so, after he had patient endured, he obtain the promise.

6:16 for men verili swear by the greater: and an oath for confirmation
i to them an end of all strife.

6:17 wherein god, will more abundantli to shew unto the heir of
promis the immut of hi counsel, confirm it by an oath: 6:18
that by two immut things, in which it wa imposs for god to
lie, we might have a strong consolation, who have fled for refug to
lay hold upon the hope set befor us: 6:19 which hope we have as an
anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast, and which entereth into
that within the veil; 6:20 whither the forerunn is for us entered,
even jesus, made an high priest for ever after the order of
melchisedec.

7:1 for thi melchisedec, king of salem, priest of the most high god,
who met abraham return from the slaughter of the kings, and blessed
him; 7:2 To whom also abraham gave a tenth part of all; first be by
interpret king of righteousness, and after that also king of
salem, which is, king of peace; 7:3 without father, without mother,
without descent, have neither begin of days, nor end of life;
but made like unto the son of god; abideth a priest continually.

7:4 now consid how great thi man was, unto whom even the patriarch
abraham gave the tenth of the spoils.

7:5 and verili they that are of the son of levi, who receiv the
offic of the priesthood, have a command to take tith of the
peopl accord to the law, that is, of their brethren, though they
com out of the loin of abraham: 7:6 but he whose descent is not
count from them receiv tith of abraham, and bless him that had
th promises.

7:7 and without all contradict the less is bless of the better.

7:8 and here men that die receiv tithes; but there he receiveth them,
of whom it is wit that he liveth.

7:9 and as I may so say, levi also, who receiveth tithes, pay tithes
in abraham.

7:10 for he wa yet in the loin of hi father, when melchisedec met
him.

7:11 If therefor perfect were by the levit priesthood, (for
und it the peopl receiv the law,) what further need wa there
that anoth priest should rise after the order of melchisedec, and
not be call after the order of aaron?  7:12 for the priesthood being
changed, there is made of necess a chang also of the law.

7:13 for he of whom these thing are spoken pertaineth to another
tribe, of which no man gave attend at the altar.

7:14 for it is evid that our lord sprang out of juda; of which
trib mose spake noth concern priesthood.

7:15 and it is yet far more evident: for that after the similitud of
melchisedec there ariseth anoth priest, 7:16 who is made, not after
th law of a carnal commandment, but after the power of an endless
life.

7:17 for he testifieth, thou art a priest for ever after the order of
melchisedec.

7:18 for there is verili a disannul of the command going
befor for the weak and unprofit thereof.

7:19 for the law made noth perfect, but the bring in of a better
hop did; by the which we draw nigh unto god.

7:20 and inasmuch as not without an oath he wa made priest: 7:21 (for
thos priest were made without an oath; but thi with an oath by him
that said unto him, the lord sware and will not repent, thou art a
priest for ever after the order of melchisedec:) 7:22 By so much was
jesu made a sureti of a better testament.

7:23 and they truli were mani priests, becaus they were not suffered
to continu by reason of death: 7:24 but thi man, becaus he
continueth ever, hath an unchang priesthood.

7:25 wherefor he is abl also to save them to the uttermost that come
unto god by him, see he ever liveth to make intercess for them.

7:26 for such an high priest becam us, who is holy, harmless,
undefiled, separ from sinners, and made higher than the heavens;
7:27 who needeth not daily, as those high priests, to offer up
sacrifice, first for hi own sins, and then for the people's: for this
h did once, when he offer up himself.

7:28 for the law maketh men high priest which have infirmity; but the
word of the oath, which wa sinc the law, maketh the son, who is
consecr for evermore.

8:1 now of the thing which we have spoken thi is the sum: We have
such an high priest, who is set on the right hand of the throne of the
majesti in the heavens; 8:2 A minist of the sanctuary, and of the
tru tabernacle, which the lord pitched, and not man.

8:3 for everi high priest is ordain to offer gift and sacrifices:
wherefor it is of necess that thi man have somewhat also to
offer.

8:4 for if he were on earth, he should not be a priest, see that
ther are priest that offer gift accord to the law: 8:5 who serve
unto the exampl and shadow of heavenli things, as mose was
admonish of god when he wa about to make the tabernacle: for, see,
saith he, that thou make all thing accord to the pattern shew to
the in the mount.

8:6 but now hath he obtain a more excel ministry, by how much
also he is the mediat of a better covenant, which wa established
upon better promises.

8:7 for if that first coven had been faultless, then should no
plac have been sought for the second.

8:8 for find fault with them, he saith, behold, the day come,
saith the lord, when I will make a new coven with the hous of
israel and with the hous of judah: 8:9 not accord to the covenant
that I made with their father in the day when I took them by the hand
to lead them out of the land of egypt; becaus they continu not in
mi covenant, and I regard them not, saith the lord.

8:10 for thi is the coven that I will make with the hous of
israel after those days, saith the lord; I will put my law into their
mind, and write them in their hearts: and I will be to them a god, and
they shall be to me a people: 8:11 and they shall not teach everi man
hi neighbour, and everi man hi brother, saying, know the lord: for
al shall know me, from the least to the greatest.

8:12 for I will be merci to their unrighteousness, and their sins
and their iniqu will I rememb no more.

8:13 In that he saith, A new covenant, he hath made the first old. now
that which decayeth and waxeth old is readi to vanish away.

9:1 then verili the first coven had also ordin of divine
service, and a worldli sanctuary.

9:2 for there wa a tabernacl made; the first, wherein wa the
candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is call the
sanctuary.

9:3 and after the second veil, the tabernacl which is call the
holiest of all; 9:4 which had the golden censer, and the ark of the
coven overlaid round about with gold, wherein wa the golden pot
that had manna, and aaron' rod that budded, and the tabl of the
covenant; 9:5 and over it the cherubim of glori shadow the
mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.

9:6 now when these thing were thu ordained, the priest went always
into the first tabernacle, accomplish the servic of god.

9:7 but into the second went the high priest alon onc everi year,
not without blood, which he offer for himself, and for the error of
th people: 9:8 the holi ghost thi signifying, that the way into the
holiest of all wa not yet made manifest, while as the first
tabernacl wa yet standing: 9:9 which wa a figur for the time then
present, in which were offer both gift and sacrifices, that could
not make him that did the servic perfect, as pertain to the
conscience; 9:10 which stood onli in meat and drinks, and divers
washings, and carnal ordinances, impos on them until the time of
reformation.

9:11 but christ be come an high priest of good thing to come, by a
great and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to
say, not of thi building; 9:12 neither by the blood of goat and
calves, but by hi own blood he enter in onc into the holi place,
hav obtain etern redempt for us.

9:13 for if the blood of bull and of goats, and the ash of an
heif sprinkl the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifi of the
flesh: 9:14 how much more shall the blood of christ, who through the
etern spirit offer himself without spot to god, purg your
consci from dead work to serv the live god?  9:15 and for this
caus he is the mediat of the new testament, that by mean of death,
for the redempt of the transgress that were under the first
testament, they which are call might receiv the promis of eternal
inheritance.

9:16 for where a testament is, there must also of necess be the
death of the testator.

9:17 for a testament is of forc after men are dead: otherwis it is
of no strength at all while the testat liveth.

9:18 whereupon neither the first testament wa dedic without
blood.

9:19 for when mose had spoken everi precept to all the people
accord to the law, he took the blood of calv and of goats, with
water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkl both the book, and
al the people, 9:20 saying, thi is the blood of the testament which
god hath enjoin unto you.

9:21 moreov he sprinkl with blood both the tabernacle, and all the
vessel of the ministry.

9:22 and almost all thing are by the law purg with blood; and
without shed of blood is no remission.

9:23 It wa therefor necessari that the pattern of thing in the
heaven should be purifi with these; but the heavenli things
themselv with better sacrific than these.

9:24 for christ is not enter into the holi place made with hands,
which are the figur of the true; but into heaven itself, now to
appear in the presenc of god for us: 9:25 nor yet that he should
off himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holi place
everi year with blood of others; 9:26 for then must he often have
suff sinc the foundat of the world: but now onc in the end of
th world hath he appear to put away sin by the sacrific of
himself.

9:27 and as it is appoint unto men onc to die, but after thi the
judgment: 9:28 So christ wa onc offer to bear the sin of many;
and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time
without sin unto salvation.

10:1 for the law have a shadow of good thing to come, and not the
veri imag of the things, can never with those sacrific which they
off year by year continu make the comer thereunto perfect.

10:2 for then would they not have ceas to be offered? becaus that
th worshipp onc purg should have had no more conscienc of
sins.

10:3 but in those sacrific there is a remembr again made of sins
everi year.

10:4 for it is not possibl that the blood of bull and of goats
should take away sins.

10:5 wherefor when he cometh into the world, he saith, sacrific and
off thou wouldest not, but a bodi hast thou prepar me: 10:6 in
burnt offer and sacrific for sin thou hast had no pleasure.

10:7 then said I, lo, I come (in the volum of the book it is written
of me,) to do thi will, O god.

10:8 abov when he said, sacrific and offer and burnt offerings
and offer for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure
therein; which are offer by the law; 10:9 then said he, lo, I come
to do thi will, O god. He taketh away the first, that he may establish
th second.

10:10 By the which will we are sanctifi through the offer of the
bodi of jesu christ onc for all.

10:11 and everi priest standeth daili minist and offering
oftentim the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins: 10:12
but thi man, after he had offer one sacrific for sin for ever,
sat down on the right hand of god; 10:13 from henceforth expecting
til hi enemi be made hi footstool.

10:14 for by one offer he hath perfect for ever them that are
sanctified.

10:15 whereof the holi ghost also is a wit to us: for after that
h had said before, 10:16 thi is the coven that I will make with
them after those days, saith the lord, I will put my law into their
hearts, and in their mind will I write them; 10:17 and their sin and
iniqu will I rememb no more.

10:18 now where remiss of these is, there is no more offer for
sin.

10:19 have therefore, brethren, bold to enter into the holiest
bi the blood of jesus, 10:20 By a new and live way, which he hath
consecr for us, through the veil, that is to say, hi flesh; 10:21
and have an high priest over the hous of god; 10:22 let us draw
near with a true heart in full assur of faith, have our hearts
sprinkl from an evil conscience, and our bodi wash with pure
water.

10:23 let us hold fast the profess of our faith without wavering;
(for he is faith that promised;) 10:24 and let us consid one
anoth to provok unto love and to good works: 10:25 not forsaking
th assembl of ourselv together, as the manner of some is; but
exhort one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day
approaching.

10:26 for if we sin wil after that we have receiv the knowledge
of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrific for sins, 10:27 but a
certain fear look for of judgment and fieri indignation, which
shal devour the adversaries.

10:28 He that despis moses' law die without merci under two or
thre witnesses: 10:29 Of how much sorer punishment, suppos ye, shall
h be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the son of god, and
hath count the blood of the covenant, wherewith he wa sanctified,
an unholi thing, and hath done despit unto the spirit of grace?
10:30 for we know him that hath said, vengeanc belongeth unto me, i
wil recompense, saith the lord. and again, the lord shall judg his
people.

10:31 It is a fear thing to fall into the hand of the live god.

10:32 but call to remembr the former days, in which, after ye were
illuminated, ye endur a great fight of afflictions; 10:33 partly,
whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproach and afflictions;
and partly, whilst ye becam companion of them that were so used.

10:34 for ye had compass of me in my bonds, and took joy the
spoil of your goods, know in yourselv that ye have in heaven a
bett and an endur substance.

10:35 cast not away therefor your confidence, which hath great
recomp of reward.

10:36 for ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will
of god, ye might receiv the promise.

10:37 for yet a littl while, and he that shall come will come, and
wil not tarry.

10:38 now the just shall live by faith: but if ani man draw back, my
soul shall have no pleasur in him.

10:39 but we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them
that believ to the save of the soul.

11:1 now faith is the substanc of thing hope for, the evid of
th not seen.

11:2 for by it the elder obtain a good report.

11:3 through faith we understand that the world were frame by the
word of god, so that thing which are seen were not made of things
which do appear.

11:4 By faith abel offer unto god a more excel sacrific than
cain, by which he obtain wit that he wa righteous, god
testifi of hi gifts: and by it he be dead yet speaketh.

11:5 By faith enoch wa translat that he should not see death; and
wa not found, becaus god had translat him: for befor his
transl he had thi testimony, that he pleas god.

11:6 but without faith it is imposs to pleas him: for he that
cometh to god must believ that he is, and that he is a reward of
them that dilig seek him.

11:7 By faith noah, be warn of god of thing not seen as yet,
mov with fear, prepar an ark to the save of hi house; by the
which he condemn the world, and becam heir of the righteousness
which is by faith.

11:8 By faith abraham, when he wa call to go out into a place which
h should after receiv for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out,
not know whither he went.

11:9 By faith he sojourn in the land of promise, as in a strange
country, dwell in tabernacl with isaac and jacob, the heir with
him of the same promise: 11:10 for he look for a citi which hath
foundations, whose builder and maker is god.

11:11 through faith also sara herself receiv strength to conceive
seed, and wa deliv of a child when she wa past age, becaus she
judg him faith who had promised.

11:12 therefor sprang there even of one, and him as good as dead, so
mani as the star of the sky in multitude, and as the sand which is by
th sea shore innumerable.

11:13 these all die in faith, not have receiv the promises, but
hav seen them afar off, and were persuad of them, and embraced
them, and confess that they were stranger and pilgrim on the
earth.

11:14 for they that say such thing declar plainli that they seek a
country.

11:15 and truly, if they had been mind of that countri from whence
they came out, they might have had opportun to have returned.

11:16 but now they desir a better country, that is, an heavenly:
wherefor god is not asham to be call their god: for he hath
prepar for them a city.

11:17 By faith abraham, when he wa tried, offer up isaac: and he
that had receiv the promis offer up hi onli begotten son, 11:18
of whom it wa said, that in isaac shall thi seed be called: 11:19
account that god wa abl to rais him up, even from the dead; from
whenc also he receiv him in a figure.

11:20 By faith isaac bless jacob and esau concern thing to come.

11:21 By faith jacob, when he wa a dying, bless both the son of
joseph; and worshipped, lean upon the top of hi staff.

11:22 By faith joseph, when he died, made mention of the depart of
th children of israel; and gave command concern hi bones.

11:23 By faith moses, when he wa born, wa hid three month of his
parents, becaus they saw he wa a proper child; and they were not
afraid of the king' commandment.

11:24 By faith moses, when he wa come to years, refus to be called
th son of pharaoh' daughter; 11:25 choos rather to suffer
afflict with the peopl of god, than to enjoy the pleasur of sin
for a season; 11:26 esteem the reproach of christ greater riches
than the treasur in egypt: for he had respect unto the recomp of
th reward.

11:27 By faith he forsook egypt, not fear the wrath of the king:
for he endured, as see him who is invisible.

11:28 through faith he kept the passover, and the sprinkl of blood,
lest he that destroy the firstborn should touch them.

11:29 By faith they pass through the red sea as by dri land: which
th egyptian assay to do were drowned.

11:30 By faith the wall of jericho fell down, after they were
compass about seven days.

11:31 By faith the harlot rahab perish not with them that believed
not, when she had receiv the spi with peace.

11:32 and what shall I more say? for the time would fail me to tell of
gedeon, and of barak, and of samson, and of jephthae; of david also,
and samuel, and of the prophets: 11:33 who through faith subdued
kingdoms, wrought righteousness, obtain promises, stop the mouths
of lions.

11:34 quench the violenc of fire, escap the edg of the sword,
out of weak were made strong, wax valiant in fight, turn to
flight the armi of the aliens.

11:35 women receiv their dead rais to life again: and other were
tortured, not accept deliverance; that they might obtain a better
resurrection: 11:36 and other had trial of cruel mock and
scourgings, yea, moreov of bond and imprisonment: 11:37 they were
stoned, they were sawn asunder, were tempted, were slain with the
sword: they wander about in sheepskin and goatskins; being
destitute, afflicted, tormented; 11:38 (of whom the world wa not
worthy:) they wander in deserts, and in mountains, and in den and
cav of the earth.

11:39 and these all, have obtain a good report through faith,
receiv not the promise: 11:40 god have provid some better thing
for us, that they without us should not be made perfect.

12:1 wherefor see we also are compass about with so great a
cloud of witnesses, let us lay asid everi weight, and the sin which
doth so easili beset us, and let us run with patienc the race that is
set befor us, 12:2 look unto jesu the author and finish of our
faith; who for the joy that wa set befor him endur the cross,
despis the shame, and is set down at the right hand of the throne
of god.

12:3 for consid him that endur such contradict of sinners
against himself, lest ye be weari and faint in your minds.

12:4 Ye have not yet resist unto blood, strive against sin.

12:5 and ye have forgotten the exhort which speaketh unto you as
unto children, My son, despis not thou the chasten of the lord,
nor faint when thou art rebuk of him: 12:6 for whom the lord loveth
h chasteneth, and scourgeth everi son whom he receiveth.

12:7 If ye endur chastening, god dealeth with you as with sons; for
what son is he whom the father chasteneth not?  12:8 but if ye be
without chastisement, whereof all are partakers, then are ye bastards,
and not sons.

12:9 furthermor we have had father of our flesh which correct us,
and we gave them reverence: shall we not much rather be in subjection
unto the father of spirits, and live?  12:10 for they verili for a few
day chasten us after their own pleasure; but he for our profit,
that we might be partak of hi holiness.

12:11 now no chasten for the present seemeth to be joyous, but
grievous: nevertheless afterward it yieldeth the peaceabl fruit of
right unto them which are exercis thereby.

12:12 wherefor lift up the hand which hang down, and the feeble
knees; 12:13 and make straight path for your feet, lest that which is
lam be turn out of the way; but let it rather be healed.

12:14 follow peac with all men, and holiness, without which no man
shal see the lord: 12:15 look dilig lest ani man fail of the
grac of god; lest ani root of bitter spring up troubl you,
and therebi mani be defiled; 12:16 lest there be ani fornicator, or
profan person, as esau, who for one morsel of meat sold his
birthright.

12:17 for ye know how that afterward, when he would have inherit the
blessing, he wa rejected: for he found no place of repentance, though
h sought it care with tears.

12:18 for ye are not come unto the mount that might be touched, and
that burn with fire, nor unto blackness, and darkness, and tempest,
12:19 and the sound of a trumpet, and the voic of words; which voice
they that heard intreat that the word should not be spoken to them
ani more: 12:20 (for they could not endur that which wa commanded,
and if so much as a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned, or
thrust through with a dart: 12:21 and so terribl wa the sight, that
mos said, I exceedingli fear and quake:) 12:22 but ye are come unto
mount sion, and unto the citi of the live god, the heavenly
jerusalem, and to an innumer compani of angels, 12:23 To the
gener assembl and church of the firstborn, which are written in
heaven, and to god the judg of all, and to the spirit of just men
mad perfect, 12:24 and to jesu the mediat of the new covenant, and
to the blood of sprinkling, that speaketh better thing than that of
abel.

12:25 see that ye refus not him that speaketh. for if they escaped
not who refus him that spake on earth, much more shall not we
escape, if we turn away from him that speaketh from heaven: 12:26
whose voic then shook the earth: but now he hath promised, saying,
yet onc more I shake not the earth only, but also heaven.

12:27 and thi word, yet onc more, signifieth the remov of those
th that are shaken, as of thing that are made, that those things
which cannot be shaken may remain.

12:28 wherefor we receiv a kingdom which cannot be moved, let us
hav grace, wherebi we may serv god accept with rever and
godli fear: 12:29 for our god is a consum fire.

13:1 let brotherli love continue.

13:2 Be not forget to entertain strangers: for therebi some have
entertain angel unawares.

13:3 rememb them that are in bonds, as bound with them; and them
which suffer adversity, as be yourselv also in the body.

13:4 marriag is honour in all, and the bed undefiled: but
whoremong and adulter god will judge.

13:5 let your convers be without covetousness; and be content
with such thing as ye have: for he hath said, I will never leave
thee, nor forsak thee.

13:6 So that we may boldli say, the lord is my helper, and I will not
fear what man shall do unto me.

13:7 rememb them which have the rule over you, who have spoken unto
y the word of god: whose faith follow, consid the end of their
conversation.

13:8 jesu christ the same yesterday, and to day, and for ever.

13:9 Be not carri about with diver and strang doctrines. for it is
a good thing that the heart be establish with grace; not with meats,
which have not profit them that have been occupi therein.

13:10 We have an altar, whereof they have no right to eat which serve
th tabernacle.

13:11 for the bodi of those beasts, whose blood is brought into the
sanctuari by the high priest for sin, are burn without the camp.

13:12 wherefor jesu also, that he might sanctifi the peopl with his
own blood, suffer without the gate.

13:13 let us go forth therefor unto him without the camp, bear his
reproach.

13:14 for here have we no continu city, but we seek one to come.

13:15 By him therefor let us offer the sacrific of prais to god
continually, that is, the fruit of our lip give thank to hi name.

13:16 but to do good and to commun forget not: for with such
sacrific god is well pleased.

13:17 obey them that have the rule over you, and submit yourselves:
for they watch for your souls, as they that must give account, that
they may do it with joy, and not with grief: for that is unprofitable
for you.

13:18 pray for us: for we trust we have a good conscience, in all
th will to live honestly.

13:19 but I beseech you the rather to do this, that I may be restored
to you the sooner.

13:20 now the god of peace, that brought again from the dead our lord
jesus, that great shepherd of the sheep, through the blood of the
everlast covenant, 13:21 make you perfect in everi good work to do
hi will, work in you that which is wellpleas in hi sight,
through jesu christ; to whom be glori for ever and ever. amen.

13:22 and I beseech you, brethren, suffer the word of exhortation: for
i have written a letter unto you in few words.

13:23 know ye that our brother timothi is set at liberty; with whom,
if he come shortly, I will see you.

13:24 salut all them that have the rule over you, and all the saints.

they of itali salut you.

13:25 grace be with you all. amen.




th gener epistl of james


1:1 james, a servant of god and of the lord jesu christ,
to the twelv tribe which are scatter abroad, greeting.

1:2 My brethren, count it all joy when ye fall into divers
temptations; 1:3 know this, that the tri of your faith worketh
patience.

1:4 but let patienc have her perfect work, that ye may be perfect and
entire, want nothing.

1:5 If ani of you lack wisdom, let him ask of god, that giveth to all
men liberally, and upbraideth not; and it shall be given him.

1:6 but let him ask in faith, noth wavering. for he that wavereth
i like a wave of the sea driven with the wind and tossed.

1:7 for let not that man think that he shall receiv ani thing of the
lord.

1:8 A doubl mind man is unstabl in all hi ways.

1:9 let the brother of low degre rejoic in that he is exalted: 1:10
but the rich, in that he is made low: becaus as the flower of the
grass he shall pass away.

1:11 for the sun is no sooner risen with a burn heat, but it
withereth the grass, and the flower thereof falleth, and the grace of
th fashion of it perisheth: so also shall the rich man fade away in
hi ways.

1:12 bless is the man that endureth temptation: for when he is
tried, he shall receiv the crown of life, which the lord hath
promis to them that love him.

1:13 let no man say when he is tempted, I am tempt of god: for god
cannot be tempt with evil, neither tempteth he ani man: 1:14 but
everi man is tempted, when he is drawn away of hi own lust, and
enticed.

1:15 then when lust hath conceived, it bringeth forth sin: and sin,
when it is finished, bringeth forth death.

1:16 Do not err, my belov brethren.

1:17 everi good gift and everi perfect gift is from above, and cometh
down from the father of lights, with whom is no variableness, neither
shadow of turning.

1:18 Of hi own will begat he us with the word of truth, that we
should be a kind of firstfruit of hi creatures.

1:19 wherefore, my belov brethren, let everi man be swift to hear,
slow to speak, slow to wrath: 1:20 for the wrath of man worketh not
th righteous of god.

1:21 wherefor lay apart all filthi and superflu of
naughtiness, and receiv with meek the engraft word, which is
abl to save your souls.

1:22 but be ye doer of the word, and not hearer only, deceiv your
own selves.

1:23 for if ani be a hearer of the word, and not a doer, he is like
unto a man behold hi natur face in a glass: 1:24 for he
beholdeth himself, and goeth hi way, and straightway forgetteth what
mann of man he was.

1:25 but whoso looketh into the perfect law of liberty, and continueth
therein, he be not a forget hearer, but a doer of the work, this
man shall be bless in hi deed.

1:26 If ani man among you seem to be religious, and bridleth not his
tongue, but deceiveth hi own heart, thi man' religion is vain.

1:27 pure religion and undefil befor god and the father is this, to
visit the fatherless and widow in their affliction, and to keep
himself unspot from the world.

2:1 My brethren, have not the faith of our lord jesu christ, the lord
of glory, with respect of persons.

2:2 for if there come unto your assembl a man with a gold ring, in
goodli apparel, and there come in also a poor man in vile raiment; 2:3
and ye have respect to him that weareth the gay clothing, and say unto
him, sit thou here in a good place; and say to the poor, stand thou
there, or sit here under my footstool: 2:4 are ye not then partial in
yourselves, and are becom judg of evil thoughts?  2:5 hearken, my
belov brethren, hath not god chosen the poor of thi world rich in
faith, and heir of the kingdom which he hath promis to them that
lov him?  2:6 but ye have despis the poor. Do not rich men oppress
you, and draw you befor the judgment seats?  2:7 Do not they
blasphem that worthi name by the which ye are called?  2:8 If ye
fulfil the royal law accord to the scripture, thou shalt love thy
neighbour as thyself, ye do well: 2:9 but if ye have respect to
persons, ye commit sin, and are convinc of the law as transgressors.

2:10 for whosoev shall keep the whole law, and yet offend in one
point, he is guilti of all.

2:11 for he that said, Do not commit adultery, said also, Do not kill.
now if thou commit no adultery, yet if thou kill, thou art becom a
transgressor of the law.
