2:12 So speak ye, and so do, as they that shall be judg by the law
of liberty.

2:13 for he shall have judgment without mercy, that hath shew no
mercy; and merci rejoiceth against judgment.

2:14 what doth it profit, my brethren, though a man say he hath faith,
and have not works? can faith save him?  2:15 If a brother or sister
b naked, and destitut of daili food, 2:16 and one of you say unto
them, depart in peace, be ye warm and filled; notwithstand ye
giv them not those thing which are need to the body; what doth it
profit?  2:17 even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being
alone.

2:18 yea, a man may say, thou hast faith, and I have works: shew me
thi faith without thi works, and I will shew thee my faith by my
works.

2:19 thou believest that there is one god; thou doest well: the devils
also believe, and tremble.

2:20 but wilt thou know, O vain man, that faith without work is dead?
2:21 wa not abraham our father justifi by works, when he had
off isaac hi son upon the altar?  2:22 seest thou how faith
wrought with hi works, and by work wa faith made perfect?  2:23 and
th scriptur wa fulfil which saith, abraham believ god, and it
wa imput unto him for righteousness: and he wa call the friend
of god.

2:24 Ye see then how that by work a man is justified, and not by
faith only.

2:25 likewis also wa not rahab the harlot justifi by works, when
sh had receiv the messengers, and had sent them out anoth way?
2:26 for as the bodi without the spirit is dead, so faith without
work is dead also.

3:1 My brethren, be not mani masters, know that we shall receive
th greater condemnation.

3:2 for in mani thing we offend all. If ani man offend not in word,
th same is a perfect man, and abl also to bridl the whole body.

3:3 behold, we put bit in the horses' mouths, that they may obey us;
and we turn about their whole body.

3:4 behold also the ships, which though they be so great, and are
driven of fierc winds, yet are they turn about with a veri small
helm, whithersoev the governor listeth.

3:5 even so the tongu is a littl member, and boasteth great things.

behold, how great a matter a littl fire kindleth!  3:6 and the tongue
i a fire, a world of iniquity: so is the tongu among our members,
that it defileth the whole body, and setteth on fire the cours of
nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

3:7 for everi kind of beasts, and of birds, and of serpents, and of
th in the sea, is tamed, and hath been tame of mankind: 3:8 but
th tongu can no man tame; it is an unruli evil, full of deadly
poison.

3:9 therewith bless we god, even the father; and therewith curs we
men, which are made after the similitud of god.

3:10 out of the same mouth proceedeth bless and cursing. my
brethren, these thing ought not so to be.

3:11 doth a fountain send forth at the same place sweet water and
bitter?  3:12 can the fig tree, my brethren, bear oliv berries?
eith a vine, figs? so can no fountain both yield salt water and
fresh.

3:13 who is a wise man and endu with knowledg among you? let him
shew out of a good convers hi work with meek of wisdom.

3:14 but if ye have bitter envi and strife in your hearts, glory
not, and lie not against the truth.

3:15 thi wisdom descendeth not from above, but is earthly, sensual,
devilish.

3:16 for where envi and strife is, there is confus and every
evil work.

3:17 but the wisdom that is from abov is first pure, then peaceable,
gentle, and easi to be intreated, full of merci and good fruits,
without partiality, and without hypocrisy.

3:18 and the fruit of righteous is sown in peac of them that make
peace.

4:1 from whenc come war and fight among you? come they not
hence, even of your lust that war in your members?  4:2 Ye lust, and
hav not: ye kill, and desir to have, and cannot obtain: ye fight and
war, yet ye have not, becaus ye ask not.

4:3 Ye ask, and receiv not, becaus ye ask amiss, that ye may consume
it upon your lusts.

4:4 Ye adulter and adulteresses, know ye not that the friendship of
th world is enmiti with god? whosoev therefor will be a friend of
th world is the enemi of god.

4:5 Do ye think that the scriptur saith in vain, the spirit that
dwelleth in us lusteth to envy?  4:6 but he giveth more grace.
wherefor he saith, god resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the
humble.

4:7 submit yourselv therefor to god. resist the devil, and he will
fle from you.

4:8 draw nigh to god, and he will draw nigh to you. cleans your
hands, ye sinners; and purifi your hearts, ye doubl minded.

4:9 Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turn to
mourning, and your joy to heaviness.

4:10 humbl yourselv in the sight of the lord, and he shall lift you
up.

4:11 speak not evil one of another, brethren. He that speaketh evil of
hi brother, and judgeth hi brother, speaketh evil of the law, and
judgeth the law: but if thou judg the law, thou art not a doer of the
law, but a judge.

4:12 there is one lawgiver, who is abl to save and to destroy: who
art thou that judgest another?  4:13 Go to now, ye that say, To day or
to morrow we will go into such a city, and continu there a year, and
buy and sell, and get gain: 4:14 wherea ye know not what shall be on
th morrow. for what is your life? It is even a vapour, that appeareth
for a littl time, and then vanisheth away.

4:15 for that ye ought to say, If the lord will, we shall live, and do
this, or that.

4:16 but now ye rejoic in your boastings: all such rejoic is evil.

4:17 therefor to him that knoweth to do good, and doeth it not, to
him it is sin.

5:1 Go to now, ye rich men, weep and howl for your miseri that shall
com upon you.

5:2 your rich are corrupted, and your garment are motheaten.

5:3 your gold and silver is cankered; and the rust of them shall be a
wit against you, and shall eat your flesh as it were fire. Ye have
heap treasur togeth for the last days.

5:4 behold, the hire of the labour who have reap down your
fields, which is of you kept back by fraud, crieth: and the cri of
them which have reap are enter into the ear of the lord of
sabaoth.

5:5 Ye have live in pleasur on the earth, and been wanton; ye have
nourish your hearts, as in a day of slaughter.

5:6 Ye have condemn and kill the just; and he doth not resist you.

5:7 Be patient therefore, brethren, unto the come of the lord.

behold, the husbandman waiteth for the preciou fruit of the earth,
and hath long patienc for it, until he receiv the earli and latter
rain.

5:8 Be ye also patient; stablish your hearts: for the come of the
lord draweth nigh.

5:9 grudg not one against another, brethren, lest ye be condemned:
behold, the judg standeth befor the door.

5:10 take, my brethren, the prophets, who have spoken in the name of
th lord, for an exampl of suffer affliction, and of patience.

5:11 behold, we count them happi which endure. Ye have heard of the
pati of job, and have seen the end of the lord; that the lord is
veri pitiful, and of tender mercy.

5:12 but abov all things, my brethren, swear not, neither by heaven,
neith by the earth, neither by ani other oath: but let your yea be
yea; and your nay, nay; lest ye fall into condemnation.

5:13 Is ani among you afflicted? let him pray. Is ani merry? let him
s psalms.

5:14 Is ani sick among you? let him call for the elder of the church;
and let them pray over him, anoint him with oil in the name of the
lord: 5:15 and the prayer of faith shall save the sick, and the lord
shal rais him up; and if he have commit sins, they shall be
forgiven him.

5:16 confess your fault one to another, and pray one for another,
that ye may be healed. the effectu fervent prayer of a righteou man
availeth much.

5:17 elia wa a man subject to like passion as we are, and he prayed
earnestli that it might not rain: and it rain not on the earth by
th space of three year and six months.

5:18 and he pray again, and the heaven gave rain, and the earth
brought forth her fruit.

5:19 brethren, if ani of you do err from the truth, and one convert
him; 5:20 let him know, that he which converteth the sinner from the
error of hi way shall save a soul from death, and shall hide a
multitud of sins.




th first epistl gener of peter


1:1 peter, an apostl of jesu christ, to the stranger scattered
throughout pontus, galatia, cappadocia, asia, and bithynia, 1:2 elect
accord to the foreknowledg of god the father, through
sanctif of the spirit, unto obedi and sprinkl of the
blood of jesu christ: grace unto you, and peace, be multiplied.

1:3 bless be the god and father of our lord jesu christ, which
accord to hi abund merci hath begotten us again unto a lively
hop by the resurrect of jesu christ from the dead, 1:4 To an
inherit incorruptible, and undefiled, and that fadeth not away,
reserv in heaven for you, 1:5 who are kept by the power of god
through faith unto salvat readi to be reveal in the last time.

1:6 wherein ye greatli rejoice, though now for a season, if need be,
y are in heavi through manifold temptations: 1:7 that the trial
of your faith, be much more preciou than of gold that perisheth,
though it be tri with fire, might be found unto prais and honour
and glori at the appear of jesu christ: 1:8 whom have not seen,
y love; in whom, though now ye see him not, yet believing, ye rejoice
with joy unspeak and full of glory: 1:9 receiv the end of your
faith, even the salvat of your souls.

1:10 Of which salvat the prophet have enquir and searched
diligently, who prophesi of the grace that should come unto you:
1:11 search what, or what manner of time the spirit of christ which
wa in them did signify, when it testifi beforehand the sufferings
of christ, and the glori that should follow.

1:12 unto whom it wa revealed, that not unto themselves, but unto us
they did minist the things, which are now report unto you by them
that have preach the gospel unto you with the holi ghost sent down
from heaven; which thing the angel desir to look into.

1:13 wherefor gird up the loin of your mind, be sober, and hope to
th end for the grace that is to be brought unto you at the revelation
of jesu christ; 1:14 As obedi children, not fashion yourselves
accord to the former lust in your ignorance: 1:15 but as he which
hath call you is holy, so be ye holi in all manner of conversation;
1:16 becaus it is written, Be ye holy; for I am holy.

1:17 and if ye call on the father, who without respect of persons
judgeth accord to everi man' work, pass the time of your
sojourn here in fear: 1:18 forasmuch as ye know that ye were not
redeem with corrupt things, as silver and gold, from your vain
convers receiv by tradit from your fathers; 1:19 but with
th preciou blood of christ, as of a lamb without blemish and without
spot: 1:20 who verili wa foreordain befor the foundat of the
world, but wa manifest in these last time for you, 1:21 who by him
do believ in god, that rais him up from the dead, and gave him
glory; that your faith and hope might be in god.

1:22 see ye have purifi your soul in obey the truth through
th spirit unto unfeign love of the brethren, see that ye love one
anoth with a pure heart fervently: 1:23 be born again, not of
corrupt seed, but of incorruptible, by the word of god, which
liveth and abideth for ever.

1:24 for all flesh is as grass, and all the glori of man as the flower
of grass. the grass withereth, and the flower thereof falleth away:
1:25 but the word of the lord endureth for ever. and thi is the word
which by the gospel is preach unto you.

2:1 wherefor lay asid all malice, and all guile, and hypocrisies,
and envies, all evil speakings, 2:2 As newborn babes, desir the
sincer milk of the word, that ye may grow thereby: 2:3 If so be ye
hav tast that the lord is gracious.

2:4 To whom coming, as unto a live stone, disallow inde of men,
but chosen of god, and precious, 2:5 Ye also, as live stones, are
built up a spiritu house, an holi priesthood, to offer up spiritual
sacrifices, accept to god by jesu christ.

2:6 wherefor also it is contain in the scripture, behold, I lay in
sion a chief corner stone, elect, precious: and he that believeth on
him shall not be confounded.

2:7 unto you therefor which believ he is precious: but unto them
which be disobedient, the stone which the builder disallowed, the
sam is made the head of the corner, 2:8 and a stone of stumbling, and
a rock of offence, even to them which stumbl at the word, being
disobedient: whereunto also they were appointed.

2:9 but ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy
nation, a peculiar people; that ye should shew forth the prais of
him who hath call you out of dark into hi marvel light;
2:10 which in time past were not a people, but are now the peopl of
god: which had not obtain mercy, but now have obtain mercy.

2:11 dearli beloved, I beseech you as stranger and pilgrims, abstain
from fleshli lusts, which war against the soul; 2:12 have your
convers honest among the gentiles: that, wherea they speak
against you as evildoers, they may by your good works, which they
shal behold, glorifi god in the day of visitation.

2:13 submit yourselv to everi ordin of man for the lord' sake:
wheth it be to the king, as supreme; 2:14 Or unto governors, as unto
them that are sent by him for the punish of evildoers, and for the
prais of them that do well.

2:15 for so is the will of god, that with well do ye may put to
sil the ignor of foolish men: 2:16 As free, and not use your
liberti for a cloke of maliciousness, but as the servant of god.

2:17 honour all men. love the brotherhood. fear god. honour the king.

2:18 servants, be subject to your master with all fear; not onli to
th good and gentle, but also to the froward.

2:19 for thi is thankworthy, if a man for conscienc toward god
endur grief, suffer wrongfully.

2:20 for what glori is it, if, when ye be buffet for your faults, ye
shal take it patiently? but if, when ye do well, and suffer for it,
y take it patiently, thi is accept with god.

2:21 for even hereunto were ye called: becaus christ also suffered
for us, leav us an example, that ye should follow hi steps: 2:22
who did no sin, neither wa guil found in hi mouth: 2:23 who, when
h wa reviled, revil not again; when he suffered, he threatened
not; but commit himself to him that judgeth righteously: 2:24 who
hi own self bare our sin in hi own bodi on the tree, that we, being
dead to sins, should live unto righteousness: by whose stripe ye were
healed.

2:25 for ye were as sheep go astray; but are now return unto the
shepherd and bishop of your souls.

3:1 likewise, ye wives, be in subject to your own husbands; that,
if ani obey not the word, they also may without the word be won by the
convers of the wives; 3:2 while they behold your chaste
convers coupl with fear.

3:3 whose adorn let it not be that outward adorn of plait the
hair, and of wear of gold, or of put on of apparel; 3:4 but let
it be the hidden man of the heart, in that which is not corruptible,
even the ornament of a meek and quiet spirit, which is in the sight of
god of great price.

3:5 for after thi manner in the old time the holi women also, who
trust in god, adorn themselves, be in subject unto their own
husbands: 3:6 even as sara obey abraham, call him lord: whose
daught ye are, as long as ye do well, and are not afraid with any
amazement.

3:7 likewise, ye husbands, dwell with them accord to knowledge,
giv honour unto the wife, as unto the weaker vessel, and as being
heir togeth of the grace of life; that your prayer be not
hindered.

3:8 finally, be ye all of one mind, have compass one of another,
lov as brethren, be pitiful, be courteous: 3:9 not render evil for
evil, or rail for railing: but contrariwis blessing; know that
y are thereunto called, that ye should inherit a blessing.

3:10 for he that will love life, and see good days, let him refrain
hi tongu from evil, and hi lip that they speak no guile: 3:11 let
him eschew evil, and do good; let him seek peace, and ensu it.

3:12 for the eye of the lord are over the righteous, and hi ear are
open unto their prayers: but the face of the lord is against them that
do evil.

3:13 and who is he that will harm you, if ye be follow of that
which is good?  3:14 but and if ye suffer for righteousness' sake,
happi are ye: and be not afraid of their terror, neither be troubled;
3:15 but sanctifi the lord god in your hearts: and be readi alway to
giv an answer to everi man that asketh you a reason of the hope that
i in you with meek and fear: 3:16 have a good conscience; that,
wherea they speak evil of you, as of evildoers, they may be ashamed
that fals accus your good convers in christ.

3:17 for it is better, if the will of god be so, that ye suffer for
wel doing, than for evil doing.

3:18 for christ also hath onc suffer for sins, the just for the
unjust, that he might bring us to god, be put to death in the
flesh, but quicken by the spirit: 3:19 By which also he went and
preach unto the spirit in prison; 3:20 which sometim were
disobedient, when onc the longsuff of god wait in the day of
noah, while the ark wa a preparing, wherein few, that is, eight souls
wer save by water.

3:21 the like figur whereunto even baptism doth also now save us (not
th put away of the filth of the flesh, but the answer of a good
consci toward god,) by the resurrect of jesu christ: 3:22 who
i gone into heaven, and is on the right hand of god; angel and
author and power be made subject unto him.

4:1 forasmuch then as christ hath suffer for us in the flesh, arm
yourselv likewis with the same mind: for he that hath suffer in
th flesh hath ceas from sin; 4:2 that he no longer should live the
rest of hi time in the flesh to the lust of men, but to the will of
god.

4:3 for the time past of our life may suffic us to have wrought the
wil of the gentiles, when we walk in lasciviousness, lusts, excess
of wine, revellings, banquetings, and abomin idolatries: 4:4
wherein they think it strang that ye run not with them to the same
excess of riot, speak evil of you: 4:5 who shall give account to
him that is readi to judg the quick and the dead.

4:6 for for thi caus wa the gospel preach also to them that are
dead, that they might be judg accord to men in the flesh, but
liv accord to god in the spirit.

4:7 but the end of all thing is at hand: be ye therefor sober, and
watch unto prayer.

4:8 and abov all thing have fervent chariti among yourselves: for
char shall cover the multitud of sins.

4:9 use hospit one to anoth without grudging.

4:10 As everi man hath receiv the gift, even so minist the same
on to another, as good steward of the manifold grace of god.

4:11 If ani man speak, let him speak as the oracl of god; if ani man
minister, let him do it as of the abil which god giveth: that god
in all thing may be glorifi through jesu christ, to whom be praise
and dominion for ever and ever. amen.

4:12 beloved, think it not strang concern the fieri trial which is
to tri you, as though some strang thing happen unto you: 4:13 but
rejoice, inasmuch as ye are partak of christ' sufferings; that,
when hi glori shall be revealed, ye may be glad also with exceeding
joy.

4:14 If ye be reproach for the name of christ, happi are ye; for the
spirit of glori and of god resteth upon you: on their part he is evil
spoken of, but on your part he is glorified.

4:15 but let none of you suffer as a murderer, or as a thief, or as an
evildoer, or as a busybodi in other men' matters.

4:16 yet if ani man suffer as a christian, let him not be ashamed; but
let him glorifi god on thi behalf.

4:17 for the time is come that judgment must begin at the hous of
god: and if it first begin at us, what shall the end be of them that
obey not the gospel of god?  4:18 and if the righteou scarc be
saved, where shall the ungodli and the sinner appear?  4:19 wherefore
let them that suffer accord to the will of god commit the keeping
of their soul to him in well doing, as unto a faith creator.

5:1 the elder which are among you I exhort, who am also an elder, and
a wit of the suffer of christ, and also a partak of the
glori that shall be revealed: 5:2 feed the flock of god which is among
you, take the oversight thereof, not by constraint, but willingly;
not for filthi lucre, but of a readi mind; 5:3 neither as be lords
ov god' heritage, but be ensampl to the flock.

5:4 and when the chief shepherd shall appear, ye shall receiv a crown
of glori that fadeth not away.

5:5 likewise, ye younger, submit yourselv unto the elder. yea, all
of you be subject one to another, and be cloth with humility: for
god resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.

5:6 humbl yourselv therefor under the mighti hand of god, that he
may exalt you in due time: 5:7 cast all your care upon him; for he
careth for you.

5:8 Be sober, be vigilant; becaus your adversari the devil, as a
roar lion, walketh about, seek whom he may devour: 5:9 whom
resist stedfast in the faith, know that the same afflict are
accomplish in your brethren that are in the world.

5:10 but the god of all grace, who hath call us unto hi eternal
glori by christ jesus, after that ye have suffer a while, make you
perfect, stablish, strengthen, settl you.

5:11 To him be glori and dominion for ever and ever. amen.

5:12 By silvanus, a faith brother unto you, as I suppose, I have
written briefly, exhorting, and testifi that thi is the true grace
of god wherein ye stand.

5:13 the church that is at babylon, elect togeth with you,
saluteth you; and so doth marcu my son.

5:14 greet ye one anoth with a kiss of charity. peac be with you
al that are in christ jesus. amen.




th second gener epistl of peter


1:1 simon peter, a servant and an apostl of jesu christ, to them
that have obtain like preciou faith with us through the
right of god and our saviour jesu christ: 1:2 grace and peace
b multipli unto you through the knowledg of god, and of jesu our
lord, 1:3 accord as hi divin power hath given unto us all things
that pertain unto life and godliness, through the knowledg of him
that hath call us to glori and virtue: 1:4 wherebi are given unto us
exceed great and preciou promises: that by these ye might be
partak of the divin nature, have escap the corrupt that is
in the world through lust.

1:5 and besid this, give all diligence, add to your faith virtue;
and to virtu knowledge; 1:6 and to knowledg temperance; and to
temper patience; and to patienc godliness; 1:7 and to godliness
brotherli kindness; and to brotherli kind charity.

1:8 for if these thing be in you, and abound, they make you that ye
shal neither be barren nor unfruit in the knowledg of our lord
jesu christ.

1:9 but he that lacketh these thing is blind, and cannot see afar
off, and hath forgotten that he wa purg from hi old sins.

1:10 wherefor the rather, brethren, give dilig to make your
cal and elect sure: for if ye do these things, ye shall never
fall: 1:11 for so an entranc shall be minist unto you abundantly
into the everlast kingdom of our lord and saviour jesu christ.

1:12 wherefor I will not be neglig to put you alway in
remembr of these things, though ye know them, and be established
in the present truth.

1:13 yea, I think it meet, as long as I am in thi tabernacle, to stir
you up by put you in remembrance; 1:14 know that shortli I must
put off thi my tabernacle, even as our lord jesu christ hath shewed
me.

1:15 moreov I will endeavour that ye may be abl after my deceas to
hav these thing alway in remembrance.

1:16 for we have not follow cunningli devis fables, when we made
known unto you the power and come of our lord jesu christ, but were
eyewit of hi majesty.

1:17 for he receiv from god the father honour and glory, when there
cam such a voic to him from the excel glory, thi is my beloved
son, in whom I am well pleased.

1:18 and thi voic which came from heaven we heard, when we were with
him in the holi mount.

1:19 We have also a more sure word of prophecy; whereunto ye do well
that ye take heed, as unto a light that shineth in a dark place, until
th day dawn, and the day star aris in your hearts: 1:20 know this
first, that no propheci of the scriptur is of ani private
interpretation.

1:21 for the propheci came not in old time by the will of man: but
holi men of god spake as they were move by the holi ghost.

2:1 but there were fals prophet also among the people, even as there
shal be fals teacher among you, who privili shall bring in damnable
heresies, even deni the lord that bought them, and bring upon
themselv swift destruction.

2:2 and mani shall follow their pernici ways; by reason of whom the
way of truth shall be evil spoken of.

2:3 and through covet shall they with feign word make
merchandis of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not,
and their damnat slumbereth not.

2:4 for if god spare not the angel that sinned, but cast them down
to hell, and deliv them into chain of darkness, to be reserved
unto judgment; 2:5 and spare not the old world, but save noah the
eighth person, a preacher of righteousness, bring in the flood upon
th world of the ungodly; 2:6 and turn the citi of sodom and
gomorrha into ash condemn them with an overthrow, make them an
ensampl unto those that after should live ungodly; 2:7 and delivered
just lot, vex with the filthi convers of the wicked: 2:8 (for
that righteou man dwell among them, in see and hearing, vexed
hi righteou soul from day to day with their unlaw deeds;) 2:9 the
lord knoweth how to deliv the godli out of temptations, and to
reserv the unjust unto the day of judgment to be punished: 2:10 but
chiefli them that walk after the flesh in the lust of uncleanness, and
despis government. presumptu are they, selfwilled, they are not
afraid to speak evil of dignities.

2:11 wherea angels, which are greater in power and might, bring not
rail accus against them befor the lord.

2:12 but these, as natur brute beasts, made to be taken and
destroyed, speak evil of the thing that they understand not; and
shal utterli perish in their own corruption; 2:13 and shall receive
th reward of unrighteousness, as they that count it pleasur to riot
in the day time. spot they are and blemishes, sport themselves
with their own deceiv while they feast with you; 2:14 have eyes
ful of adultery, and that cannot ceas from sin; beguil unstable
souls: an heart they have exercis with covet practices; cursed
children: 2:15 which have forsaken the right way, and are gone astray,
follow the way of balaam the son of bosor, who love the wage of
unrighteousness; 2:16 but wa rebuk for hi iniquity: the dumb ass
speak with man' voic forbad the mad of the prophet.

2:17 these are well without water, cloud that are carri with a
tempest; to whom the mist of dark is reserv for ever.

2:18 for when they speak great swell word of vanity, they allure
through the lust of the flesh, through much wantonness, those that
wer clean escap from them who live in error.

2:19 while they promis them liberty, they themselv are the servants
of corruption: for of whom a man is overcome, of the same is he
brought in bondage.

2:20 for if after they have escap the pollut of the world
through the knowledg of the lord and saviour jesu christ, they are
again entangl therein, and overcome, the latter end is wors with
them than the beginning.

2:21 for it had been better for them not to have known the way of
righteousness, than, after they have known it, to turn from the holy
command deliv unto them.

2:22 but it is happen unto them accord to the true proverb, the
dog is turn to hi own vomit again; and the sow that wa wash to
her wallow in the mire.

3:1 thi second epistle, beloved, I now write unto you; in both which
i stir up your pure mind by way of remembrance: 3:2 that ye may be
mind of the word which were spoken befor by the holi prophets,
and of the command of us the apostl of the lord and saviour: 3:3
know thi first, that there shall come in the last day scoffers,
walk after their own lusts, 3:4 and saying, where is the promis of
hi coming? for sinc the father fell asleep, all thing continu as
they were from the begin of the creation.

3:5 for thi they willingli are ignor of, that by the word of god
th heaven were of old, and the earth stand out of the water and
in the water: 3:6 wherebi the world that then was, be overflowed
with water, perished: 3:7 but the heaven and the earth, which are
now, by the same word are kept in store, reserv unto fire against
th day of judgment and perdit of ungodli men.

3:8 but, beloved, be not ignor of thi one thing, that one day is
with the lord as a thousand years, and a thousand year as one day.

3:9 the lord is not slack concern hi promise, as some men count
slackness; but is longsuff to us-ward, not will that any
should perish, but that all should come to repentance.

3:10 but the day of the lord will come as a thief in the night; in the
which the heaven shall pass away with a great noise, and the elements
shal melt with fervent heat, the earth also and the work that are
therein shall be burn up.

3:11 see then that all these thing shall be dissolved, what manner
of person ought ye to be in all holi convers and godliness, 3:12
look for and hast unto the come of the day of god, wherein the
heaven be on fire shall be dissolved, and the element shall melt
with fervent heat?  3:13 nevertheless we, accord to hi promise,
look for new heaven and a new earth, wherein dwelleth righteousness.

3:14 wherefore, beloved, see that ye look for such things, be
dilig that ye may be found of him in peace, without spot, and
blameless.

3:15 and account that the longsuff of our lord is salvation; even
a our belov brother paul also accord to the wisdom given unto
him hath written unto you; 3:16 As also in all hi epistles, speaking
in them of these things; in which are some thing hard to be
understood, which they that are unlearn and unstabl wrest, as they
do also the other scriptures, unto their own destruction.

3:17 Ye therefore, beloved, see ye know these thing before, beware
lest ye also, be led away with the error of the wicked, fall from
your own stedfastness.

3:18 but grow in grace, and in the knowledg of our lord and saviour
jesu christ. To him be glori both now and for ever. amen.




th first epistl gener of john


1:1 that which wa from the beginning, which we have heard, which we
hav seen with our eyes, which we have look upon, and our hand have
handled, of the word of life; 1:2 (for the life wa manifested, and we
hav seen it, and bear witness, and shew unto you that etern life,
which wa with the father, and wa manifest unto us;) 1:3 that which
w have seen and heard declar we unto you, that ye also may have
fellowship with us: and truli our fellowship is with the father, and
with hi son jesu christ.

1:4 and these thing write we unto you, that your joy may be full.

1:5 thi then is the messag which we have heard of him, and declare
unto you, that god is light, and in him is no dark at all.

1:6 If we say that we have fellowship with him, and walk in darkness,
w lie, and do not the truth: 1:7 but if we walk in the light, as he
i in the light, we have fellowship one with another, and the blood of
jesu christ hi son cleanseth us from all sin.

1:8 If we say that we have no sin, we deceiv ourselves, and the truth
i not in us.

1:9 If we confess our sins, he is faith and just to forgiv us our
sins, and to cleans us from all unrighteousness.

1:10 If we say that we have not sinned, we make him a liar, and his
word is not in us.

2:1 My littl children, these thing write I unto you, that ye sin
not.

and if ani man sin, we have an advoc with the father, jesu christ
th righteous: 2:2 and he is the propiti for our sins: and not
for our' only, but also for the sin of the whole world.

2:3 and herebi we do know that we know him, if we keep his
commandments.

2:4 He that saith, I know him, and keepeth not hi commandments, is a
liar, and the truth is not in him.

2:5 but whoso keepeth hi word, in him verili is the love of god
perfected: herebi know we that we are in him.

2:6 He that saith he abideth in him ought himself also so to walk,
even as he walked.

2:7 brethren, I write no new command unto you, but an old
command which ye had from the beginning. the old command is
th word which ye have heard from the beginning.

2:8 again, a new command I write unto you, which thing is true in
him and in you: becaus the dark is past, and the true light now
shineth.

2:9 He that saith he is in the light, and hateth hi brother, is in
dark even until now.

2:10 He that loveth hi brother abideth in the light, and there is
non occas of stumbl in him.

2:11 but he that hateth hi brother is in darkness, and walketh in
darkness, and knoweth not whither he goeth, becaus that dark hath
blind hi eyes.

2:12 I write unto you, littl children, becaus your sin are forgiven
y for hi name' sake.

2:13 I write unto you, fathers, becaus ye have known him that is from
th beginning. I write unto you, young men, becaus ye have overcome
th wick one. I write unto you, littl children, becaus ye have
known the father.

2:14 I have written unto you, fathers, becaus ye have known him that
i from the beginning. I have written unto you, young men, becaus ye
ar strong, and the word of god abideth in you, and ye have overcome
th wick one.

2:15 love not the world, neither the thing that are in the world. if
ani man love the world, the love of the father is not in him.

2:16 for all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust
of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the father, but is of
th world.

2:17 and the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that
doeth the will of god abideth for ever.

2:18 littl children, it is the last time: and as ye have heard that
antichrist shall come, even now are there mani antichrists; wherebi we
know that it is the last time.

2:19 they went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had
been of us, they would no doubt have continu with us: but they went
out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

2:20 but ye have an unction from the holi one, and ye know all things.

2:21 I have not written unto you becaus ye know not the truth, but
becaus ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

2:22 who is a liar but he that denieth that jesu is the christ? He is
antichrist, that denieth the father and the son.

2:23 whosoev denieth the son, the same hath not the father: he that
acknowledgeth the son hath the father also.

2:24 let that therefor abid in you, which ye have heard from the
beginning. If that which ye have heard from the begin shall remain
in you, ye also shall continu in the son, and in the father.

2:25 and thi is the promis that he hath promis us, even eternal
life.

2:26 these thing have I written unto you concern them that seduce
you.

2:27 but the anoint which ye have receiv of him abideth in you,
and ye need not that ani man teach you: but as the same anointing
teacheth you of all things, and is truth, and is no lie, and even as
it hath taught you, ye shall abid in him.

2:28 and now, littl children, abid in him; that, when he shall
appear, we may have confidence, and not be asham befor him at his
coming.

2:29 If ye know that he is righteous, ye know that everi one that
doeth righteous is born of him.

3:1 behold, what manner of love the father hath bestow upon us, that
w should be call the son of god: therefor the world knoweth us
not, becaus it knew him not.

3:2 beloved, now are we the son of god, and it doth not yet appear
what we shall be: but we know that, when he shall appear, we shall be
lik him; for we shall see him as he is.

3:3 and everi man that hath thi hope in him purifieth himself, even
a he is pure.

3:4 whosoev committeth sin transgresseth also the law: for sin is
th transgress of the law.

3:5 and ye know that he wa manifest to take away our sins; and in
him is no sin.

3:6 whosoev abideth in him sinneth not: whosoev sinneth hath not
seen him, neither known him.

3:7 littl children, let no man deceiv you: he that doeth
right is righteous, even as he is righteous.

3:8 He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from
th beginning. for thi purpos the son of god wa manifested, that he
might destroy the work of the devil.

3:9 whosoev is born of god doth not commit sin; for hi seed
remaineth in him: and he cannot sin, becaus he is born of god.

3:10 In thi the children of god are manifest, and the children of the
devil: whosoev doeth not righteous is not of god, neither he
that loveth not hi brother.

3:11 for thi is the messag that ye heard from the beginning, that we
should love one another.

3:12 not as cain, who wa of that wick one, and slew hi brother.
and wherefor slew he him? becaus hi own work were evil, and his
brother' righteous.

3:13 marvel not, my brethren, if the world hate you.

3:14 We know that we have pass from death unto life, becaus we love
th brethren. He that loveth not hi brother abideth in death.

3:15 whosoev hateth hi brother is a murderer: and ye know that no
murder hath etern life abid in him.

3:16 herebi perceiv we the love of god, becaus he laid down hi life
for us: and we ought to lay down our live for the brethren.

3:17 but whoso hath thi world' good, and seeth hi brother have
need, and shutteth up hi bowel of compass from him, how dwelleth
th love of god in him?  3:18 My littl children, let us not love in
word, neither in tongue; but in deed and in truth.

3:19 and herebi we know that we are of the truth, and shall assur our
heart befor him.

3:20 for if our heart condemn us, god is greater than our heart, and
knoweth all things.

3:21 beloved, if our heart condemn us not, then have we confidence
toward god.

3:22 and whatsoev we ask, we receiv of him, becaus we keep his
commandments, and do those thing that are pleas in hi sight.

3:23 and thi is hi commandment, that we should believ on the name
of hi son jesu christ, and love one another, as he gave us
commandment.

3:24 and he that keepeth hi command dwelleth in him, and he in
him.

and herebi we know that he abideth in us, by the spirit which he hath
given us.

4:1 beloved, believ not everi spirit, but tri the spirit whether
they are of god: becaus mani fals prophet are gone out into the
world.

4:2 herebi know ye the spirit of god: everi spirit that confesseth
that jesu christ is come in the flesh is of god: 4:3 and everi spirit
that confesseth not that jesu christ is come in the flesh is not of
god: and thi is that spirit of antichrist, whereof ye have heard that
it should come; and even now alreadi is it in the world.

4:4 Ye are of god, littl children, and have overcom them: because
great is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.

4:5 they are of the world: therefor speak they of the world, and the
world heareth them.

4:6 We are of god: he that knoweth god heareth us; he that is not of
god heareth not us. herebi know we the spirit of truth, and the spirit
of error.

4:7 beloved, let us love one another: for love is of god; and every
on that loveth is born of god, and knoweth god.

4:8 He that loveth not knoweth not god; for god is love.

4:9 In thi wa manifest the love of god toward us, becaus that god
sent hi onli begotten son into the world, that we might live through
him.

4:10 herein is love, not that we love god, but that he love us, and
sent hi son to be the propiti for our sins.

4:11 beloved, if god so love us, we ought also to love one another.

4:12 No man hath seen god at ani time. If we love one another, god
dwelleth in us, and hi love is perfect in us.

4:13 herebi know we that we dwell in him, and he in us, becaus he
hath given us of hi spirit.

4:14 and we have seen and do testifi that the father sent the son to
b the saviour of the world.

4:15 whosoev shall confess that jesu is the son of god, god
dwelleth in him, and he in god.

4:16 and we have known and believ the love that god hath to us. god
i love; and he that dwelleth in love dwelleth in god, and god in him.

4:17 herein is our love made perfect, that we may have bold in the
day of judgment: becaus as he is, so are we in thi world.

4:18 there is no fear in love; but perfect love casteth out fear:
becaus fear hath torment. He that feareth is not made perfect in
love.

4:19 We love him, becaus he first love us.

4:20 If a man say, I love god, and hateth hi brother, he is a liar:
for he that loveth not hi brother whom he hath seen, how can he love
god whom he hath not seen?  4:21 and thi command have we from
him, that he who loveth god love hi brother also.

5:1 whosoev believeth that jesu is the christ is born of god: and
everi one that loveth him that begat loveth him also that is begotten
of him.

5:2 By thi we know that we love the children of god, when we love
god, and keep hi commandments.

5:3 for thi is the love of god, that we keep hi commandments: and
hi command are not grievous.

5:4 for whatsoev is born of god overcometh the world: and thi is
th victori that overcometh the world, even our faith.

5:5 who is he that overcometh the world, but he that believeth that
jesu is the son of god?  5:6 thi is he that came by water and blood,
even jesu christ; not by water only, but by water and blood. and it
i the spirit that beareth witness, becaus the spirit is truth.

5:7 for there are three that bear record in heaven, the father, the
word, and the holi ghost: and these three are one.

5:8 and there are three that bear wit in earth, the spirit, and
th water, and the blood: and these three agre in one.

5:9 If we receiv the wit of men, the wit of god is greater:
for thi is the wit of god which he hath testifi of hi son.

5:10 He that believeth on the son of god hath the wit in himself:
h that believeth not god hath made him a liar; becaus he believeth
not the record that god gave of hi son.

5:11 and thi is the record, that god hath given to us etern life,
and thi life is in hi son.

5:12 He that hath the son hath life; and he that hath not the son of
god hath not life.

5:13 these thing have I written unto you that believ on the name of
th son of god; that ye may know that ye have etern life, and that
y may believ on the name of the son of god.

5:14 and thi is the confid that we have in him, that, if we ask
ani thing accord to hi will, he heareth us: 5:15 and if we know
that he hear us, whatsoev we ask, we know that we have the petitions
that we desir of him.

5:16 If ani man see hi brother sin a sin which is not unto death, he
shal ask, and he shall give him life for them that sin not unto
death. there is a sin unto death: I do not say that he shall pray for
it.

5:17 all unright is sin: and there is a sin not unto death.

5:18 We know that whosoev is born of god sinneth not; but he that is
begotten of god keepeth himself, and that wick one toucheth him not.

5:19 and we know that we are of god, and the whole world lieth in
wickedness.

5:20 and we know that the son of god is come, and hath given us an
understanding, that we may know him that is true, and we are in him
that is true, even in hi son jesu christ. thi is the true god, and
etern life.

5:21 littl children, keep yourselv from idols. amen.




th second epistl gener of john


1:1 the elder unto the elect ladi and her children, whom I love in
th truth; and not I only, but also all they that have known the
truth; 1:2 for the truth' sake, which dwelleth in us, and shall be
with us for ever.

1:3 grace be with you, mercy, and peace, from god the father, and from
th lord jesu christ, the son of the father, in truth and love.

1:4 I rejoic greatli that I found of thi children walk in truth,
a we have receiv a command from the father.

1:5 and now I beseech thee, lady, not as though I wrote a new
command unto thee, but that which we had from the beginning, that
w love one another.

1:6 and thi is love, that we walk after hi commandments. thi is the
commandment, that, as ye have heard from the beginning, ye should walk
in it.

1:7 for mani deceiv are enter into the world, who confess not
that jesu christ is come in the flesh. thi is a deceiv and an
antichrist.

1:8 look to yourselves, that we lose not those thing which we have
wrought, but that we receiv a full reward.

1:9 whosoev transgresseth, and abideth not in the doctrin of
christ, hath not god. He that abideth in the doctrin of christ, he
hath both the father and the son.

1:10 If there come ani unto you, and bring not thi doctrine, receive
him not into your house, neither bid him god speed: 1:11 for he that
biddeth him god speed is partak of hi evil deeds.

1:12 have mani thing to write unto you, I would not write with
pap and ink: but I trust to come unto you, and speak face to face,
that our joy may be full.

1:13 the children of thi elect sister greet thee. amen.




th third epistl gener of john


1:1 the elder unto the wellbelov gaius, whom I love in the truth.

1:2 beloved, I wish abov all thing that thou mayest prosper and be
in health, even as thi soul prospereth.

1:3 for I rejoic greatly, when the brethren came and testifi of
th truth that is in thee, even as thou walkest in the truth.

1:4 I have no greater joy than to hear that my children walk in truth.

1:5 beloved, thou doest faith whatsoev thou doest to the
brethren, and to strangers; 1:6 which have born wit of thy
char befor the church: whom if thou bring forward on their journey
aft a godli sort, thou shalt do well: 1:7 becaus that for his
name' sake they went forth, take noth of the gentiles.

1:8 We therefor ought to receiv such, that we might be fellowhelpers
to the truth.

1:9 I wrote unto the church: but diotrephes, who loveth to have the
preemin among them, receiveth us not.

1:10 wherefore, if I come, I will rememb hi deed which he doeth,
prat against us with malici words: and not content therewith,
neith doth he himself receiv the brethren, and forbiddeth them that
would, and casteth them out of the church.

1:11 beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is good.
h that doeth good is of god: but he that doeth evil hath not seen
god.

1:12 demetriu hath good report of all men, and of the truth itself:
yea, and we also bear record; and ye know that our record is true.

1:13 I had mani thing to write, but I will not with ink and pen write
unto thee: 1:14 but I trust I shall shortli see thee, and we shall
speak face to face. peac be to thee. our friend salut thee. greet
th friend by name.




th gener epistl of jude


1:1 jude, the servant of jesu christ, and brother of james, to them
that are sanctifi by god the father, and preserv in jesu christ,
and called: 1:2 merci unto you, and peace, and love, be multiplied.

1:3 beloved, when I gave all dilig to write unto you of the common
salvation, it wa need for me to write unto you, and exhort you
that ye should earnestli contend for the faith which wa once
deliv unto the saints.

1:4 for there are certain men crept in unawares, who were befor of
old ordain to thi condemnation, ungodli men, turn the grace of
our god into lasciviousness, and deni the onli lord god, and our
lord jesu christ.

1:5 I will therefor put you in remembrance, though ye onc knew this,
how that the lord, have save the peopl out of the land of egypt,
afterward destroy them that believ not.

1:6 and the angel which kept not their first estate, but left their
own habitation, he hath reserv in everlast chain under darkness
unto the judgment of the great day.

1:7 even as sodom and gomorrha, and the citi about them in like
manner, give themselv over to fornication, and go after strange
flesh, are set forth for an example, suffer the vengeanc of
etern fire.

1:8 likewis also these filthi dreamer defil the flesh, despise
dominion, and speak evil of dignities.

1:9 yet michael the archangel, when contend with the devil he
disput about the bodi of moses, durst not bring against him a
rail accusation, but said, the lord rebuk thee.

1:10 but these speak evil of those thing which they know not: but
what they know naturally, as brute beasts, in those thing they
corrupt themselves.

1:11 woe unto them! for they have gone in the way of cain, and ran
greedili after the error of balaam for reward, and perish in the
gainsay of core.

1:12 these are spot in your feast of charity, when they feast with
you, feed themselv without fear: cloud they are without water,
carri about of winds; tree whose fruit withereth, without fruit,
twic dead, pluck up by the roots; 1:13 rage wave of the sea,
foam out their own shame; wander stars, to whom is reserv the
black of dark for ever.

1:14 and enoch also, the seventh from adam, prophesi of these,
saying, behold, the lord cometh with ten thousand of hi saints, 1:15
to execut judgment upon all, and to convinc all that are ungodly
among them of all their ungodli deed which they have ungodly
committed, and of all their hard speech which ungodli sinner have
spoken against him.

1:16 these are murmurers, complainers, walk after their own lusts;
and their mouth speaketh great swell words, have men' person in
admir becaus of advantage.

1:17 but, beloved, rememb ye the word which were spoken befor of
th apostl of our lord jesu christ; 1:18 how that they told you
ther should be mocker in the last time, who should walk after their
own ungodli lusts.

1:19 these be they who separ themselves, sensual, have not the
spirit.

1:20 but ye, beloved, build up yourselv on your most holi faith,
pray in the holi ghost, 1:21 keep yourselv in the love of god,
look for the merci of our lord jesu christ unto etern life.

1:22 and of some have compassion, make a difference: 1:23 and others
sav with fear, pull them out of the fire; hate even the garment
spot by the flesh.

1:24 now unto him that is abl to keep you from falling, and to
pres you faultless befor the presenc of hi glori with exceeding
joy, 1:25 To the onli wise god our saviour, be glori and majesty,
dominion and power, both now and ever. amen.




th revel of saint john the devine


1:1 the revel of jesu christ, which god gave unto him, to shew
unto hi servant thing which must shortli come to pass; and he sent
and signifi it by hi angel unto hi servant john: 1:2 who bare
record of the word of god, and of the testimoni of jesu christ, and
of all thing that he saw.

1:3 bless is he that readeth, and they that hear the word of this
prophecy, and keep those thing which are written therein: for the
tim is at hand.

1:4 john to the seven church which are in asia: grace be unto you,
and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and
from the seven spirit which are befor hi throne; 1:5 and from jesus
christ, who is the faith witness, and the first begotten of the
dead, and the princ of the king of the earth. unto him that loved
us, and wash us from our sin in hi own blood, 1:6 and hath made us
k and priest unto god and hi father; to him be glori and
dominion for ever and ever. amen.

1:7 behold, he cometh with clouds; and everi eye shall see him, and
they also which pierc him: and all kindr of the earth shall wail
becaus of him. even so, amen.

1:8 I am alpha and omega, the begin and the ending, saith the
lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the almighty.

1:9 I john, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation,
and in the kingdom and patienc of jesu christ, wa in the isl that
i call patmos, for the word of god, and for the testimoni of jesus
christ.

1:10 I wa in the spirit on the lord' day, and heard behind me a
great voice, as of a trumpet, 1:11 saying, I am alpha and omega, the
first and the last: and, what thou seest, write in a book, and send it
unto the seven church which are in asia; unto ephesus, and unto
smyrna, and unto pergamos, and unto thyatira, and unto sardis, and
unto philadelphia, and unto laodicea.

1:12 and I turn to see the voic that spake with me. and being
turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks; 1:13 and in the midst of the
seven candlestick one like unto the son of man, cloth with a
gar down to the foot, and girt about the pap with a golden
girdle.

1:14 hi head and hi hair were white like wool, as white as snow;
and hi eye were as a flame of fire; 1:15 and hi feet like unto fine
brass, as if they burn in a furnace; and hi voic as the sound of
mani waters.

1:16 and he had in hi right hand seven stars: and out of hi mouth
went a sharp twoedg sword: and hi counten wa as the sun
shineth in hi strength.

1:17 and when I saw him, I fell at hi feet as dead. and he laid his
right hand upon me, say unto me, fear not; I am the first and the
last: 1:18 I am he that liveth, and wa dead; and, behold, I am alive
for evermore, amen; and have the key of hell and of death.

1:19 write the thing which thou hast seen, and the thing which are,
and the thing which shall be hereafter; 1:20 the mysteri of the seven
star which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden
candlesticks. the seven star are the angel of the seven churches:
and the seven candlestick which thou sawest are the seven churches.

2:1 unto the angel of the church of ephesu write; these thing saith
h that holdeth the seven star in hi right hand, who walketh in the
midst of the seven golden candlesticks; 2:2 I know thi works, and thy
labour, and thi patience, and how thou canst not bear them which are
evil: and thou hast tri them which say they are apostles, and are
not, and hast found them liars: 2:3 and hast borne, and hast patience,
and for my name' sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

2:4 nevertheless I have somewhat against thee, becaus thou hast left
thi first love.

2:5 rememb therefor from whenc thou art fallen, and repent, and do
th first works; or els I will come unto thee quickly, and will
remov thi candlestick out of hi place, except thou repent.

2:6 but thi thou hast, that thou hatest the deed of the
nicolaitanes, which I also hate.

2:7 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of
life, which is in the midst of the paradis of god.

2:8 and unto the angel of the church in smyrna write; these things
saith the first and the last, which wa dead, and is alive; 2:9 I know
thi works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and i
know the blasphemi of them which say they are jews, and are not, but
ar the synagogu of satan.

2:10 fear none of those thing which thou shalt suffer: behold, the
devil shall cast some of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye
shal have tribul ten days: be thou faith unto death, and i
wil give thee a crown of life.

2:11 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.

2:12 and to the angel of the church in pergamo write; these things
saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges; 2:13 I know thy
works, and where thou dwellest, even where satan' seat is: and thou
holdest fast my name, and hast not deni my faith, even in those days
wherein antipa wa my faith martyr, who wa slain among you, where
satan dwelleth.

2:14 but I have a few thing against thee, becaus thou hast there
them that hold the doctrin of balaam, who taught balac to cast a
stumblingblock befor the children of israel, to eat thing sacrificed
unto idols, and to commit fornication.

2:15 So hast thou also them that hold the doctrin of the
nicolaitanes, which thing I hate.

2:16 repent; or els I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight
against them with the sword of my mouth.

2:17 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden
manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name
written, which no man knoweth save he that receiveth it.

2:18 and unto the angel of the church in thyatira write; these things
saith the son of god, who hath hi eye like unto a flame of fire, and
hi feet are like fine brass; 2:19 I know thi works, and charity, and
service, and faith, and thi patience, and thi works; and the last to
b more than the first.

2:20 notwithstand I have a few thing against thee, becaus thou
sufferest that woman jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to
teach and to seduc my servant to commit fornication, and to eat
th sacrif unto idols.

2:21 and I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she
rep not.

2:22 behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery
with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.

2:23 and I will kill her children with death; and all the churches
shal know that I am he which searcheth the rein and hearts: and i
wil give unto everi one of you accord to your works.

2:24 but unto you I say, and unto the rest in thyatira, as mani as
hav not thi doctrine, and which have not known the depth of satan,
a they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.

2:25 but that which ye have alreadi hold fast till I come.

2:26 and he that overcometh, and keepeth my work unto the end, to him
wil I give power over the nations: 2:27 and he shall rule them with a
rod of iron; as the vessel of a potter shall they be broken to
shivers: even as I receiv of my father.

2:28 and I will give him the morn star.

2:29 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches.

3:1 and unto the angel of the church in sardi write; these things
saith he that hath the seven spirit of god, and the seven stars; i
know thi works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

3:2 Be watchful, and strengthen the thing which remain, that are
readi to die: for I have not found thi work perfect befor god.

3:3 rememb therefor how thou hast receiv and heard, and hold
fast, and repent. If therefor thou shalt not watch, I will come on
the as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon
thee.

3:4 thou hast a few name even in sardi which have not defil their
garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.

3:5 He that overcometh, the same shall be cloth in white raiment;
and I will not blot out hi name out of the book of life, but I will
confess hi name befor my father, and befor hi angels.

3:6 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches.

3:7 and to the angel of the church in philadelphia write; these things
saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of david,
h that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man
openeth; 3:8 I know thi works: behold, I have set befor thee an open
door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a littl strength, and
hast kept my word, and hast not deni my name.

3:9 behold, I will make them of the synagogu of satan, which say they
ar jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come
and worship befor thi feet, and to know that I have love thee.

3:10 becaus thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep
the from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world,
to tri them that dwell upon the earth.

3:11 behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no
man take thi crown.

3:12 him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the templ of my god,
and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my
god, and the name of the citi of my god, which is new jerusalem, which
cometh down out of heaven from my god: and I will write upon him my
new name.

3:13 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches.

3:14 and unto the angel of the church of the laodicean write; these
th saith the amen, the faith and true witness, the begin of
th creation of god; 3:15 I know thi works, that thou art neither cold
nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.

3:16 So then becaus thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, i
wil spue thee out of my mouth.

3:17 becaus thou sayest, I am rich, and increas with goods, and
hav need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and
miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked: 3:18 I counsel thee to buy
of me gold tri in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white
raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy
naked do not appear; and anoint thine eye with eyesalve, that
thou mayest see.

3:19 As mani as I love, I rebuk and chasten: be zealou therefore,
and repent.

3:20 behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if ani man hear my voice,
and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and
h with me.

3:21 To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne,
even as I also overcame, and am set down with my father in hi throne.

3:22 He that hath an ear, let him hear what the spirit saith unto the
churches.

4:1 after thi I looked, and, behold, a door wa open in heaven: and
th first voic which I heard wa as it were of a trumpet talk with
me; which said, come up hither, and I will shew thee thing which must
b hereafter.

4:2 and immedi I wa in the spirit: and, behold, a throne wa set
in heaven, and one sat on the throne.

4:3 and he that sat wa to look upon like a jasper and a sardine
stone: and there wa a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like
unto an emerald.

4:4 and round about the throne were four and twenti seats: and upon
th seat I saw four and twenti elder sitting, cloth in white
raiment; and they had on their head crown of gold.

4:5 and out of the throne proceed lightn and thunder and
voices: and there were seven lamp of fire burn befor the throne,
which are the seven spirit of god.

4:6 and befor the throne there wa a sea of glass like unto crystal:
and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four
beast full of eye befor and behind.

4:7 and the first beast wa like a lion, and the second beast like a
calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast
wa like a fli eagle.

4:8 and the four beast had each of them six wing about him; and they
wer full of eye within: and they rest not day and night, saying,
holy, holy, holy, lord god almighty, which was, and is, and is to
come.

4:9 and when those beast give glori and honour and thank to him that
sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever, 4:10 the four and
twenti elder fall down befor him that sat on the throne, and worship
him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crown befor the
throne, saying, 4:11 thou art worthy, O lord, to receiv glori and
honour and power: for thou hast creat all things, and for thy
pleasur they are and were created.

5:1 and I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book
written within and on the backside, seal with seven seals.

5:2 and I saw a strong angel proclaim with a loud voice, who is
worthi to open the book, and to loos the seal thereof?  5:3 and no
man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, wa abl to open
th book, neither to look thereon.

5:4 and I wept much, becaus no man wa found worthi to open and to
read the book, neither to look thereon.

5:5 and one of the elder saith unto me, weep not: behold, the lion of
th tribe of juda, the root of david, hath prevail to open the book,
and to loos the seven seal thereof.

5:6 and I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four
beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a lamb as it had been
slain, have seven horn and seven eyes, which are the seven spirits
of god sent forth into all the earth.

5:7 and he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that
sat upon the throne.

5:8 and when he had taken the book, the four beast and four and
twenti elder fell down befor the lamb, have everi one of them
harps, and golden vial full of odours, which are the prayer of
saints.

5:9 and they sung a new song, saying, thou art worthi to take the
book, and to open the seal thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast
redeem us to god by thi blood out of everi kindred, and tongue, and
people, and nation; 5:10 and hast made us unto our god king and
priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

5:11 and I beheld, and I heard the voic of mani angel round about
th throne and the beast and the elders: and the number of them was
ten thousand time ten thousand, and thousand of thousands; 5:12
say with a loud voice, worthi is the lamb that wa slain to receive
power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory,
and blessing.

5:13 and everi creatur which is in heaven, and on the earth, and
und the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them,
heard I saying, blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto
him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the lamb for ever and ever.

5:14 and the four beast said, amen. and the four and twenti elders
fel down and worship him that liveth for ever and ever.

6:1 and I saw when the lamb open one of the seals, and I heard, as
it were the nois of thunder, one of the four beast saying, come and
see.

6:2 and I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a
bow; and a crown wa given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and
to conquer.

6:3 and when he had open the second seal, I heard the second beast
say, come and see.

6:4 and there went out anoth hors that wa red: and power wa given
to him that sat thereon to take peac from the earth, and that they
should kill one another: and there wa given unto him a great sword.

6:5 and when he had open the third seal, I heard the third beast
say, come and see. and I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat
on him had a pair of balanc in hi hand.

6:6 and I heard a voic in the midst of the four beast say, A measure
of wheat for a penny, and three measur of barley for a penny; and
se thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

6:7 and when he had open the fourth seal, I heard the voic of the
fourth beast say, come and see.

6:8 and I looked, and behold a pale horse: and hi name that sat on
him wa death, and hell follow with him. and power wa given unto
them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with
hunger, and with death, and with the beast of the earth.

6:9 and when he had open the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the
soul of them that were slain for the word of god, and for the
testimoni which they held: 6:10 and they cri with a loud voice,
saying, how long, O lord, holi and true, dost thou not judg and
aveng our blood on them that dwell on the earth?  6:11 and white
rob were given unto everi one of them; and it wa said unto them,
that they should rest yet for a littl season, until their
fellowserv also and their brethren, that should be kill as they
were, should be fulfilled.

6:12 and I beheld when he had open the sixth seal, and, lo, there
wa a great earthquake; and the sun becam black as sackcloth of hair,
and the moon becam as blood; 6:13 and the star of heaven fell unto
th earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untim figs, when she is
shaken of a mighti wind.

6:14 and the heaven depart as a scroll when it is roll together;
and everi mountain and island were move out of their places.

6:15 and the king of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men,
and the chief captains, and the mighti men, and everi bondman, and
everi free man, hid themselv in the den and in the rock of the
mountains; 6:16 and said to the mountain and rocks, fall on us, and
hid us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the
wrath of the lamb: 6:17 for the great day of hi wrath is come; and
who shall be abl to stand?  7:1 and after these thing I saw four
angel stand on the four corner of the earth, hold the four
wind of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on
th sea, nor on ani tree.

7:2 and I saw anoth angel ascend from the east, have the seal
of the live god: and he cri with a loud voic to the four angels,
to whom it wa given to hurt the earth and the sea, 7:3 saying, hurt
not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have seal the
serv of our god in their foreheads.

7:4 and I heard the number of them which were sealed: and there were
s an hundr and forti and four thousand of all the tribe of the
children of israel.

7:5 Of the tribe of juda were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of
reuben were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of gad were sealed
twelv thousand.

7:6 Of the tribe of aser were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of
nephthalim were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of manass were
s twelv thousand.

7:7 Of the tribe of simeon were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe
of levi were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of issachar were
s twelv thousand.

7:8 Of the tribe of zabulon were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe
of joseph were seal twelv thousand. Of the tribe of benjamin were
s twelv thousand.

7:9 after thi I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man
could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues,
stood befor the throne, and befor the lamb, cloth with white
robes, and palm in their hands; 7:10 and cri with a loud voice,
saying, salvat to our god which sitteth upon the throne, and unto
th lamb.

7:11 and all the angel stood round about the throne, and about the
eld and the four beasts, and fell befor the throne on their faces,
and worship god, 7:12 saying, amen: blessing, and glory, and
wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might, be unto
our god for ever and ever. amen.

7:13 and one of the elder answered, say unto me, what are these
which are array in white robes? and whenc came they?  7:14 and i
said unto him, sir, thou knowest. and he said to me, these are they
which came out of great tribulation, and have wash their robes, and
mad them white in the blood of the lamb.

7:15 therefor are they befor the throne of god, and serv him day
and night in hi temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell
among them.

7:16 they shall hunger no more, neither thirst ani more; neither shall
th sun light on them, nor ani heat.

7:17 for the lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them,
and shall lead them unto live fountain of waters: and god shall
wip away all tear from their eyes.

8:1 and when he had open the seventh seal, there wa silenc in
heaven about the space of half an hour.

8:2 and I saw the seven angel which stood befor god; and to them
wer given seven trumpets.

8:3 and anoth angel came and stood at the altar, have a golden
censer; and there wa given unto him much incense, that he should
off it with the prayer of all saint upon the golden altar which
wa befor the throne.

8:4 and the smoke of the incense, which came with the prayer of the
saints, ascend up befor god out of the angel' hand.

8:5 and the angel took the censer, and fill it with fire of the
altar, and cast it into the earth: and there were voices, and
thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.

8:6 and the seven angel which had the seven trumpet prepared
themselv to sound.

8:7 the first angel sounded, and there follow hail and fire mingled
with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of
tre wa burnt up, and all green grass wa burnt up.

8:8 and the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain
burn with fire wa cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea
becam blood; 8:9 and the third part of the creatur which were in
th sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ship were
destroyed.

8:10 and the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from
heaven, burn as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of
th rivers, and upon the fountain of waters; 8:11 and the name of the
star is call wormwood: and the third part of the water became
wormwood; and mani men die of the waters, becaus they were made
bitter.

8:12 and the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was
smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the
stars; so as the third part of them wa darkened, and the day shone
not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.

8:13 and I beheld, and heard an angel fli through the midst of
heaven, say with a loud voice, woe, woe, woe, to the inhabit of
th earth by reason of the other voic of the trumpet of the three
angels, which are yet to sound!  9:1 and the fifth angel sounded, and
i saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him wa given the
key of the bottomless pit.

9:2 and he open the bottomless pit; and there aros a smoke out of
th pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were
darken by reason of the smoke of the pit.

9:3 and there came out of the smoke locust upon the earth: and unto
them wa given power, as the scorpion of the earth have power.

9:4 and it wa command them that they should not hurt the grass of
th earth, neither ani green thing, neither ani tree; but onli those
men which have not the seal of god in their foreheads.

9:5 and to them it wa given that they should not kill them, but that
they should be torment five months: and their torment wa as the
tor of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.

9:6 and in those day shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and
shal desir to die, and death shall flee from them.

9:7 and the shape of the locust were like unto hors prepar unto
battle; and on their head were as it were crown like gold, and their
fac were as the face of men.

9:8 and they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as
th teeth of lions.

9:9 and they had breastplates, as it were breastplat of iron; and
th sound of their wing wa as the sound of chariot of mani horses
run to battle.

9:10 and they had tail like unto scorpions, and there were sting in
their tails: and their power wa to hurt men five months.

9:11 and they had a king over them, which is the angel of the
bottomless pit, whose name in the hebrew tongu is abaddon, but in the
greek tongu hath hi name apollyon.

9:12 one woe is past; and, behold, there come two woe more hereafter.

9:13 and the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voic from the four
horn of the golden altar which is befor god, 9:14 say to the
sixth angel which had the trumpet, loos the four angel which are
bound in the great river euphrates.

9:15 and the four angel were loosed, which were prepar for an hour,
and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.

9:16 and the number of the armi of the horsemen were two hundred
thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.

9:17 and thu I saw the hors in the vision, and them that sat on
them, have breastplat of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and
th head of the hors were as the head of lions; and out of their
mouth issu fire and smoke and brimstone.

9:18 By these three wa the third part of men killed, by the fire, and
bi the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issu out of their mouths.

9:19 for their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their
tail were like unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do
hurt.

9:20 and the rest of the men which were not kill by these plagues
yet repent not of the work of their hands, that they should not
worship devils, and idol of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone,
and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk: 9:21 neither
rep they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their
fornication, nor of their thefts.

10:1 and I saw anoth mighti angel come down from heaven, clothed
with a cloud: and a rainbow wa upon hi head, and hi face wa as it
wer the sun, and hi feet as pillar of fire: 10:2 and he had in his
hand a littl book open: and he set hi right foot upon the sea, and
hi left foot on the earth, 10:3 and cri with a loud voice, as when
a lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunder utter their
voices.

10:4 and when the seven thunder had utter their voices, I wa about
to write: and I heard a voic from heaven say unto me, seal up
thos thing which the seven thunder uttered, and write them not.

10:5 and the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth
lift up hi hand to heaven, 10:6 and sware by him that liveth for
ev and ever, who creat heaven, and the thing that therein are,
and the earth, and the thing that therein are, and the sea, and the
th which are therein, that there should be time no longer: 10:7
but in the day of the voic of the seventh angel, when he shall begin
to sound, the mysteri of god should be finished, as he hath declared
to hi servant the prophets.

10:8 and the voic which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and
said, Go and take the littl book which is open in the hand of the
angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.

10:9 and I went unto the angel, and said unto him, give me the little
book. and he said unto me, take it, and eat it up; and it shall make
thi belli bitter, but it shall be in thi mouth sweet as honey.

10:10 and I took the littl book out of the angel' hand, and ate it
up; and it wa in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten
it, my belli wa bitter.

10:11 and he said unto me, thou must prophesi again befor many
peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.

11:1 and there wa given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel
stood, saying, rise, and measur the templ of god, and the altar, and
them that worship therein.

11:2 but the court which is without the templ leav out, and measure
it not; for it is given unto the gentiles: and the holi citi shall
they tread under foot forti and two months.

11:3 and I will give power unto my two witnesses, and they shall
prophesi a thousand two hundr and threescor days, cloth in
sackcloth.

11:4 these are the two oliv trees, and the two candlestick standing
befor the god of the earth.

11:5 and if ani man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their
mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if ani man will hurt them, he
must in thi manner be killed.

11:6 these have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the day of
their prophecy: and have power over water to turn them to blood, and
to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

11:7 and when they shall have finish their testimony, the beast that
ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and
shal overcom them, and kill them.

11:8 and their dead bodi shall lie in the street of the great city,
which spiritu is call sodom and egypt, where also our lord was
crucified.

11:9 and they of the peopl and kindr and tongu and nation shall
se their dead bodi three day and an half, and shall not suffer
their dead bodi to be put in graves.

11:10 and they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoic over them, and
mak merry, and shall send gift one to another; becaus these two
prophet torment them that dwelt on the earth.

11:11 and after three day and an half the spirit of life from god
ent into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell
upon them which saw them.

11:12 and they heard a great voic from heaven say unto them, come
up hither. and they ascend up to heaven in a cloud; and their
enemi beheld them.

11:13 and the same hour wa there a great earthquake, and the tenth
part of the citi fell, and in the earthquak were slain of men seven
thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glori to the god
of heaven.

11:14 the second woe is past; and, behold, the third woe cometh
quickly.

11:15 and the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voic in
heaven, saying, the kingdom of thi world are becom the kingdom of
our lord, and of hi christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.

11:16 and the four and twenti elders, which sat befor god on their
seats, fell upon their faces, and worship god, 11:17 saying, we
giv thee thanks, O lord god almighty, which art, and wast, and art to
come; becaus thou hast taken to thee thi great power, and hast
reigned.

11:18 and the nation were angry, and thi wrath is come, and the time
of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give
reward unto thi servant the prophets, and to the saints, and them
that fear thi name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which
destroy the earth.

11:19 and the templ of god wa open in heaven, and there wa seen
in hi templ the ark of hi testament: and there were lightnings, and
voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

12:1 and there appear a great wonder in heaven; a woman cloth with
th sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of
