twelv stars: 12:2 and she be with child cried, travail in
birth, and pain to be delivered.

12:3 and there appear anoth wonder in heaven; and behold a great
r dragon, have seven head and ten horns, and seven crown upon
hi heads.

12:4 and hi tail drew the third part of the star of heaven, and did
cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood befor the woman which
wa readi to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was
born.

12:5 and she brought forth a man child, who wa to rule all nations
with a rod of iron: and her child wa caught up unto god, and to his
throne.

12:6 and the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place
prepar of god, that they should feed her there a thousand two
hundr and threescor days.

12:7 and there wa war in heaven: michael and hi angel fought
against the dragon; and the dragon fought and hi angels, 12:8 and
prevail not; neither wa their place found ani more in heaven.

12:9 and the great dragon wa cast out, that old serpent, call the
devil, and satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he wa cast out
into the earth, and hi angel were cast out with him.

12:10 and I heard a loud voic say in heaven, now is come
salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our god, and the power of
hi christ: for the accus of our brethren is cast down, which
accus them befor our god day and night.

12:11 and they overcam him by the blood of the lamb, and by the word
of their testimony; and they love not their live unto the death.

12:12 therefor rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. woe to
th inhabit of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down
unto you, have great wrath, becaus he knoweth that he hath but a
short time.

12:13 and when the dragon saw that he wa cast unto the earth, he
persecut the woman which brought forth the man child.

12:14 and to the woman were given two wing of a great eagle, that she
might fli into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished
for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

12:15 and the serpent cast out of hi mouth water as a flood after the
woman, that he might caus her to be carri away of the flood.

12:16 and the earth help the woman, and the earth open her mouth,
and swallow up the flood which the dragon cast out of hi mouth.

12:17 and the dragon wa wroth with the woman, and went to make war
with the remnant of her seed, which keep the command of god, and
hav the testimoni of jesu christ.

13:1 and I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out
of the sea, have seven head and ten horns, and upon hi horn ten
crowns, and upon hi head the name of blasphemy.

13:2 and the beast which I saw wa like unto a leopard, and hi feet
wer as the feet of a bear, and hi mouth as the mouth of a lion: and
th dragon gave him hi power, and hi seat, and great authority.

13:3 and I saw one of hi head as it were wound to death; and his
deadli wound wa healed: and all the world wonder after the beast.

13:4 and they worship the dragon which gave power unto the beast:
and they worship the beast, saying, who is like unto the beast? who
i abl to make war with him?  13:5 and there wa given unto him a
mouth speak great thing and blasphemies; and power wa given unto
him to continu forti and two months.

13:6 and he open hi mouth in blasphemi against god, to blaspheme
hi name, and hi tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.

13:7 and it wa given unto him to make war with the saints, and to
overcom them: and power wa given him over all kindreds, and tongues,
and nations.

13:8 and all that dwell upon the earth shall worship him, whose names
ar not written in the book of life of the lamb slain from the
found of the world.

13:9 If ani man have an ear, let him hear.

13:10 He that leadeth into captiv shall go into captivity: he that
killeth with the sword must be kill with the sword. here is the
pati and the faith of the saints.

13:11 and I beheld anoth beast come up out of the earth; and he
had two horn like a lamb, and he spake as a dragon.

13:12 and he exerciseth all the power of the first beast befor him,
and causeth the earth and them which dwell therein to worship the
first beast, whose deadli wound wa healed.

13:13 and he doeth great wonders, so that he maketh fire come down
from heaven on the earth in the sight of men, 13:14 and deceiveth them
that dwell on the earth by the mean of those miracl which he had
pow to do in the sight of the beast; say to them that dwell on
th earth, that they should make an imag to the beast, which had the
wound by a sword, and did live.

13:15 and he had power to give life unto the imag of the beast, that
th imag of the beast should both speak, and caus that as mani as
would not worship the imag of the beast should be killed.

13:16 and he causeth all, both small and great, rich and poor, free
and bond, to receiv a mark in their right hand, or in their
foreheads: 13:17 and that no man might buy or sell, save he that had
th mark, or the name of the beast, or the number of hi name.

13:18 here is wisdom. let him that hath understand count the number
of the beast: for it is the number of a man; and hi number is six
hundr threescor and six.

14:1 and I looked, and, lo, a lamb stood on the mount sion, and with
him an hundr forti and four thousand, have hi father' name
written in their foreheads.

14:2 and I heard a voic from heaven, as the voic of mani waters, and
a the voic of a great thunder: and I heard the voic of harpers
harp with their harps: 14:3 and they sung as it were a new song
befor the throne, and befor the four beasts, and the elders: and no
man could learn that song but the hundr and forti and four thousand,
which were redeem from the earth.

14:4 these are they which were not defil with women; for they are
virgins. these are they which follow the lamb whithersoev he goeth.
thes were redeem from among men, be the firstfruit unto god and
to the lamb.

14:5 and in their mouth wa found no guile: for they are without fault
befor the throne of god.

14:6 and I saw anoth angel fli in the midst of heaven, have the
everlast gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to
everi nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people, 14:7 say with a
loud voice, fear god, and give glori to him; for the hour of his
judg is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the
sea, and the fountain of waters.

14:8 and there follow anoth angel, saying, babylon is fallen, is
fallen, that great city, becaus she made all nation drink of the
win of the wrath of her fornication.

14:9 and the third angel follow them, say with a loud voice, if
ani man worship the beast and hi image, and receiv hi mark in his
forehead, or in hi hand, 14:10 the same shall drink of the wine of
th wrath of god, which is pour out without mixtur into the cup of
hi indignation; and he shall be torment with fire and brimston in
th presenc of the holi angels, and in the presenc of the lamb:
14:11 and the smoke of their torment ascendeth up for ever and ever:
and they have no rest day nor night, who worship the beast and his
image, and whosoev receiveth the mark of hi name.

14:12 here is the patienc of the saints: here are they that keep the
command of god, and the faith of jesus.

14:13 and I heard a voic from heaven say unto me, write, blessed
ar the dead which die in the lord from henceforth: yea, saith the
spirit, that they may rest from their labours; and their work do
follow them.

14:14 and I looked, and behold a white cloud, and upon the cloud one
sat like unto the son of man, have on hi head a golden crown, and
in hi hand a sharp sickle.

14:15 and anoth angel came out of the temple, cri with a loud
voic to him that sat on the cloud, thrust in thi sickle, and reap:
for the time is come for thee to reap; for the harvest of the earth is
ripe.

14:16 and he that sat on the cloud thrust in hi sickl on the earth;
and the earth wa reaped.

14:17 and anoth angel came out of the templ which is in heaven, he
also have a sharp sickle.

14:18 and anoth angel came out from the altar, which had power over
fire; and cri with a loud cri to him that had the sharp sickle,
saying, thrust in thi sharp sickle, and gather the cluster of the
vin of the earth; for her grape are fulli ripe.

14:19 and the angel thrust in hi sickl into the earth, and gathered
th vine of the earth, and cast it into the great winepress of the
wrath of god.

14:20 and the winepress wa trodden without the city, and blood came
out of the winepress, even unto the hors bridles, by the space of a
thousand and six hundr furlongs.

15:1 and I saw anoth sign in heaven, great and marvellous, seven
angel have the seven last plagues; for in them is fill up the
wrath of god.

15:2 and I saw as it were a sea of glass mingl with fire: and them
that had gotten the victori over the beast, and over hi image, and
ov hi mark, and over the number of hi name, stand on the sea of
glass, have the harp of god.

15:3 and they sing the song of mose the servant of god, and the song
of the lamb, saying, great and marvel are thi works, lord god
almighty; just and true are thi ways, thou king of saints.

15:4 who shall not fear thee, O lord, and glorifi thi name? for thou
onli art holy: for all nation shall come and worship befor thee; for
thi judgment are made manifest.

15:5 and after that I looked, and, behold, the templ of the
tabernacl of the testimoni in heaven wa opened: 15:6 and the seven
angel came out of the temple, have the seven plagues, cloth in
pur and white linen, and have their breast gird with golden
girdles.

golden vial full of the wrath of god, who liveth for ever and ever.

15:8 and the templ wa fill with smoke from the glori of god, and
from hi power; and no man wa abl to enter into the temple, till the
seven plagu of the seven angel were fulfilled.

16:1 and I heard a great voic out of the templ say to the seven
angels, Go your ways, and pour out the vial of the wrath of god upon
th earth.

16:2 and the first went, and pour out hi vial upon the earth; and
ther fell a noisom and grievou sore upon the men which had the mark
of the beast, and upon them which worship hi image.

16:3 and the second angel pour out hi vial upon the sea; and it
becam as the blood of a dead man: and everi live soul die in the
sea.

16:4 and the third angel pour out hi vial upon the river and
fountain of waters; and they becam blood.

16:5 and I heard the angel of the water say, thou art righteous, o
lord, which art, and wast, and shalt be, becaus thou hast judged
thus.

16:6 for they have shed the blood of saint and prophets, and thou
hast given them blood to drink; for they are worthy.

16:7 and I heard anoth out of the altar say, even so, lord god
almighty, true and righteou are thi judgments.

16:8 and the fourth angel pour out hi vial upon the sun; and power
wa given unto him to scorch men with fire.

16:9 and men were scorch with great heat, and blasphem the name of
god, which hath power over these plagues: and they repent not to
giv him glory.

16:10 and the fifth angel pour out hi vial upon the seat of the
beast; and hi kingdom wa full of darkness; and they gnaw their
tongu for pain, 16:11 and blasphem the god of heaven becaus of
their pain and their sores, and repent not of their deeds.

16:12 and the sixth angel pour out hi vial upon the great river
euphrates; and the water thereof wa dri up, that the way of the
k of the east might be prepared.

16:13 and I saw three unclean spirit like frog come out of the mouth
of the dragon, and out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth
of the fals prophet.

16:14 for they are the spirit of devils, work miracles, which go
forth unto the king of the earth and of the whole world, to gather
them to the battl of that great day of god almighty.

16:15 behold, I come as a thief. bless is he that watcheth, and
keepeth hi garments, lest he walk naked, and they see hi shame.

16:16 and he gather them togeth into a place call in the hebrew
tongu armageddon.

16:17 and the seventh angel pour out hi vial into the air; and
ther came a great voic out of the templ of heaven, from the throne,
saying, It is done.

16:18 and there were voices, and thunders, and lightnings; and there
wa a great earthquake, such as wa not sinc men were upon the earth,
so mighti an earthquake, and so great.

16:19 and the great citi wa divid into three parts, and the cities
of the nation fell: and great babylon came in remembr befor god,
to give unto her the cup of the wine of the fierc of hi wrath.

16:20 and everi island fled away, and the mountain were not found.

16:21 and there fell upon men a great hail out of heaven, everi stone
about the weight of a talent: and men blasphem god becaus of the
plagu of the hail; for the plagu thereof wa exceed great.

17:1 and there came one of the seven angel which had the seven vials,
and talk with me, say unto me, come hither; I will shew unto thee
th judgment of the great whore that sitteth upon mani waters: 17:2
with whom the king of the earth have commit fornication, and the
inhabit of the earth have been made drunk with the wine of her
fornication.

17:3 So he carri me away in the spirit into the wilderness: and i
saw a woman sit upon a scarlet colour beast, full of name of
blasphemy, have seven head and ten horns.

17:4 and the woman wa array in purpl and scarlet colour, and
deck with gold and preciou stone and pearls, have a golden cup
in her hand full of abomin and filthi of her fornication:
17:5 and upon her forehead wa a name written, mystery, babylon the
great, the mother OF harlot and abomin OF the earth.

17:6 and I saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saints, and
with the blood of the martyr of jesus: and when I saw her, I wondered
with great admiration.

17:7 and the angel said unto me, wherefor didst thou marvel? I will
tel thee the mysteri of the woman, and of the beast that carrieth
her, which hath the seven head and ten horns.

17:8 the beast that thou sawest was, and is not; and shall ascend out
of the bottomless pit, and go into perdition: and they that dwell on
th earth shall wonder, whose name were not written in the book of
lif from the foundat of the world, when they behold the beast that
was, and is not, and yet is.

17:9 and here is the mind which hath wisdom. the seven head are seven
mountains, on which the woman sitteth.

17:10 and there are seven kings: five are fallen, and one is, and the
oth is not yet come; and when he cometh, he must continu a short
space.

17:11 and the beast that was, and is not, even he is the eighth, and
i of the seven, and goeth into perdition.

17:12 and the ten horn which thou sawest are ten kings, which have
receiv no kingdom as yet; but receiv power as king one hour with
th beast.

17:13 these have one mind, and shall give their power and strength
unto the beast.

17:14 these shall make war with the lamb, and the lamb shall overcome
them: for he is lord of lords, and king of kings: and they that are
with him are called, and chosen, and faithful.

17:15 and he saith unto me, the water which thou sawest, where the
whor sitteth, are peoples, and multitudes, and nations, and tongues.

17:16 and the ten horn which thou sawest upon the beast, these shall
hat the whore, and shall make her desol and naked, and shall eat
her flesh, and burn her with fire.

17:17 for god hath put in their heart to fulfil hi will, and to
agree, and give their kingdom unto the beast, until the word of god
shal be fulfilled.

17:18 and the woman which thou sawest is that great city, which
reigneth over the king of the earth.

18:1 and after these thing I saw anoth angel come down from heaven,
hav great power; and the earth wa lighten with hi glory.

18:2 and he cri mightili with a strong voice, saying, babylon the
great is fallen, is fallen, and is becom the habit of devils,
and the hold of everi foul spirit, and a cage of everi unclean and
hat bird.

18:3 for all nation have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her
fornication, and the king of the earth have commit fornication
with her, and the merchant of the earth are wax rich through the
abund of her delicacies.

18:4 and I heard anoth voic from heaven, saying, come out of her,
mi people, that ye be not partak of her sins, and that ye receive
not of her plagues.

18:5 for her sin have reach unto heaven, and god hath remembered
h iniquities.

18:6 reward her even as she reward you, and doubl unto her double
accord to her works: in the cup which she hath fill fill to her
double.

18:7 how much she hath glorifi herself, and live deliciously, so
much torment and sorrow give her: for she saith in her heart, I sit a
queen, and am no widow, and shall see no sorrow.

18:8 therefor shall her plagu come in one day, death, and mourning,
and famine; and she shall be utterli burn with fire: for strong is
th lord god who judgeth her.

18:9 and the king of the earth, who have commit fornic and
liv delici with her, shall bewail her, and lament for her, when
they shall see the smoke of her burning, 18:10 stand afar off for
th fear of her torment, saying, alas, ala that great citi babylon,
that mighti city! for in one hour is thi judgment come.

18:11 and the merchant of the earth shall weep and mourn over her;
for no man buyeth their merchandis ani more: 18:12 the merchandis of
gold, and silver, and preciou stones, and of pearls, and fine linen,
and purple, and silk, and scarlet, and all thyin wood, and all manner
vessel of ivory, and all manner vessel of most preciou wood, and of
brass, and iron, and marble, 18:13 and cinnamon, and odours, and
ointments, and frankincense, and wine, and oil, and fine flour, and
wheat, and beasts, and sheep, and horses, and chariots, and slaves,
and soul of men.

18:14 and the fruit that thi soul lust after are depart from
thee, and all thing which were dainti and goodli are depart from
thee, and thou shalt find them no more at all.

18:15 the merchant of these things, which were made rich by her,
shal stand afar off for the fear of her torment, weep and wailing,
18:16 and saying, alas, ala that great city, that wa cloth in fine
linen, and purple, and scarlet, and deck with gold, and precious
stones, and pearls!  18:17 for in one hour so great rich is come to
nought. and everi shipmaster, and all the compani in ships, and
sailors, and as mani as trade by sea, stood afar off, 18:18 and cried
when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, what citi is like unto
thi great city!  18:19 and they cast dust on their heads, and cried,
weep and wailing, saying, alas, ala that great city, wherein were
mad rich all that had ship in the sea by reason of her costliness!
for in one hour is she made desolate.

18:20 rejoic over her, thou heaven, and ye holi apostl and
prophets; for god hath aveng you on her.

18:21 and a mighti angel took up a stone like a great millstone, and
cast it into the sea, saying, thu with violenc shall that great city
babylon be thrown down, and shall be found no more at all.

18:22 and the voic of harpers, and musicians, and of pipers, and
trumpeters, shall be heard no more at all in thee; and no craftsman,
of whatsoev craft he be, shall be found ani more in thee; and the
sound of a millston shall be heard no more at all in thee; 18:23 and
th light of a candl shall shine no more at all in thee; and the
voic of the bridegroom and of the bride shall be heard no more at all
in thee: for thi merchant were the great men of the earth; for by thy
sorceri were all nation deceived.

18:24 and in her wa found the blood of prophets, and of saints, and
of all that were slain upon the earth.

19:1 and after these thing I heard a great voic of much peopl in
heaven, saying, alleluia; salvation, and glory, and honour, and power,
unto the lord our god: 19:2 for true and righteou are hi judgments:
for he hath judg the great whore, which did corrupt the earth with
her fornication, and hath aveng the blood of hi servant at her
hand.

19:3 and again they said, alleluia and her smoke rose up for ever and
ever.

19:4 and the four and twenti elder and the four beast fell down and
worship god that sat on the throne, saying, amen; alleluia.

19:5 and a voic came out of the throne, saying, prais our god, all
y hi servants, and ye that fear him, both small and great.

19:6 and I heard as it were the voic of a great multitude, and as the
voic of mani waters, and as the voic of mighti thunderings, saying,
alleluia: for the lord god omnipot reigneth.

19:7 let us be glad and rejoice, and give honour to him: for the
marriag of the lamb is come, and hi wife hath made herself ready.

19:8 and to her wa grant that she should be array in fine linen,
clean and white: for the fine linen is the righteous of saints.

19:9 and he saith unto me, write, bless are they which are called
unto the marriag supper of the lamb. and he saith unto me, these are
th true say of god.

19:10 and I fell at hi feet to worship him. and he said unto me, see
thou do it not: I am thi fellowservant, and of thi brethren that have
th testimoni of jesus: worship god: for the testimoni of jesu is the
spirit of prophecy.

19:11 and I saw heaven opened, and behold a white horse; and he that
sat upon him wa call faith and true, and in righteous he
doth judg and make war.

19:12 hi eye were as a flame of fire, and on hi head were many
crowns; and he had a name written, that no man knew, but he himself.

19:13 and he wa cloth with a vestur dip in blood: and hi name
i call the word of god.

19:14 and the armi which were in heaven follow him upon white
horses, cloth in fine linen, white and clean.

19:15 and out of hi mouth goeth a sharp sword, that with it he should
smit the nations: and he shall rule them with a rod of iron: and he
treadeth the winepress of the fierc and wrath of almighti god.

19:16 and he hath on hi vestur and on hi thigh a name written, king
of kings, and lord OF lords.

19:17 and I saw an angel stand in the sun; and he cri with a loud
voice, say to all the fowl that fli in the midst of heaven, come
and gather yourselv togeth unto the supper of the great god; 19:18
that ye may eat the flesh of kings, and the flesh of captains, and the
flesh of mighti men, and the flesh of horses, and of them that sit on
them, and the flesh of all men, both free and bond, both small and
great.

19:19 and I saw the beast, and the king of the earth, and their
armies, gather togeth to make war against him that sat on the
horse, and against hi army.

19:20 and the beast wa taken, and with him the fals prophet that
wrought miracl befor him, with which he deceiv them that had
receiv the mark of the beast, and them that worship hi image.
thes both were cast aliv into a lake of fire burn with brimstone.

19:21 and the remnant were slain with the sword of him that sat upon
th horse, which sword proceed out of hi mouth: and all the fowls
wer fill with their flesh.

20:1 and I saw an angel come down from heaven, have the key of the
bottomless pit and a great chain in hi hand.

20:2 and he laid hold on the dragon, that old serpent, which is the
devil, and satan, and bound him a thousand years, 20:3 and cast him
into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him,
that he should deceiv the nation no more, till the thousand years
should be fulfilled: and after that he must be loos a littl season.

20:4 and I saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment wa given
unto them: and I saw the soul of them that were behead for the
wit of jesus, and for the word of god, and which had not
worship the beast, neither hi image, neither had receiv hi mark
upon their foreheads, or in their hands; and they live and reigned
with christ a thousand years.

20:5 but the rest of the dead live not again until the thousand years
wer finished. thi is the first resurrection.

20:6 bless and holi is he that hath part in the first resurrection:
on such the second death hath no power, but they shall be priest of
god and of christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.

20:7 and when the thousand year are expired, satan shall be loosed
out of hi prison, 20:8 and shall go out to deceiv the nation which
ar in the four quarter of the earth, gog, and magog, to gather them
togeth to battle: the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.

20:9 and they went up on the breadth of the earth, and compass the
camp of the saint about, and the belov city: and fire came down
from god out of heaven, and devour them.

20:10 and the devil that deceiv them wa cast into the lake of fire
and brimstone, where the beast and the fals prophet are, and shall be
tor day and night for ever and ever.

20:11 and I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from
whos face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there wa found no
plac for them.

20:12 and I saw the dead, small and great, stand befor god; and the
book were opened: and anoth book wa opened, which is the book of
life: and the dead were judg out of those thing which were written
in the books, accord to their works.

20:13 and the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and
hel deliv up the dead which were in them: and they were judged
everi man accord to their works.

20:14 and death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. thi is the
second death.

20:15 and whosoev wa not found written in the book of life wa cast
into the lake of fire.

21:1 and I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and
th first earth were pass away; and there wa no more sea.

21:2 and I john saw the holi city, new jerusalem, come down from god
out of heaven, prepar as a bride adorn for her husband.

21:3 and I heard a great voic out of heaven saying, behold, the
tabernacl of god is with men, and he will dwell with them, and they
shal be hi people, and god himself shall be with them, and be their
god.

21:4 and god shall wipe away all tear from their eyes; and there
shal be no more death, neither sorrow, nor crying, neither shall
ther be ani more pain: for the former thing are pass away.

21:5 and he that sat upon the throne said, behold, I make all things
new.

and he said unto me, write: for these word are true and faithful.

21:6 and he said unto me, It is done. I am alpha and omega, the
begin and the end. I will give unto him that is athirst of the
fountain of the water of life freely.

21:7 He that overcometh shall inherit all things; and I will be his
god, and he shall be my son.

21:8 but the fearful, and unbelieving, and the abominable, and
murderers, and whoremongers, and sorcerers, and idolaters, and all
liars, shall have their part in the lake which burneth with fire and
brimstone: which is the second death.

21:9 and there came unto me one of the seven angel which had the
seven vial full of the seven last plagues, and talk with me,
saying, come hither, I will shew thee the bride, the lamb' wife.

21:10 and he carri me away in the spirit to a great and high
mountain, and shew me that great city, the holi jerusalem,
descend out of heaven from god, 21:11 have the glori of god: and
her light wa like unto a stone most precious, even like a jasper
stone, clear as crystal; 21:12 and had a wall great and high, and had
twelv gates, and at the gate twelv angels, and name written
thereon, which are the name of the twelv tribe of the children of
israel: 21:13 On the east three gates; on the north three gates; on
th south three gates; and on the west three gates.

21:14 and the wall of the citi had twelv foundations, and in them the
nam of the twelv apostl of the lamb.

21:15 and he that talk with me had a golden reed to measur the
city, and the gate thereof, and the wall thereof.

21:16 and the citi lieth foursquare, and the length is as larg as the
breadth: and he measur the citi with the reed, twelv thousand
furlongs.

th length and the breadth and the height of it are equal.

21:17 and he measur the wall thereof, an hundr and forti and four
cubits, accord to the measur of a man, that is, of the angel.

21:18 and the build of the wall of it wa of jasper: and the city
wa pure gold, like unto clear glass.

21:19 and the foundat of the wall of the citi were garnish with
al manner of preciou stones. the first foundat wa jasper; the
second, sapphire; the third, a chalcedony; the fourth, an emerald;
21:20 the fifth, sardonyx; the sixth, sardius; the seventh,
chrysolyte; the eighth, beryl; the ninth, a topaz; the tenth, a
chrysoprasus; the eleventh, a jacinth; the twelfth, an amethyst.

21:21 and the twelv gate were twelv pearls: everi sever gate was
of one pearl: and the street of the citi wa pure gold, as it were
transpar glass.

21:22 and I saw no templ therein: for the lord god almighti and the
lamb are the templ of it.

21:23 and the citi had no need of the sun, neither of the moon, to
shin in it: for the glori of god did lighten it, and the lamb is the
light thereof.

21:24 and the nation of them which are save shall walk in the light
of it: and the king of the earth do bring their glori and honour into
it.

21:25 and the gate of it shall not be shut at all by day: for there
shal be no night there.

21:26 and they shall bring the glori and honour of the nation into
it.

21:27 and there shall in no wise enter into it ani thing that
defileth, neither whatsoev worketh abomination, or maketh a lie: but
they which are written in the lamb' book of life.

22:1 and he shew me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal,
proceed out of the throne of god and of the lamb.

22:2 In the midst of the street of it, and on either side of the
river, wa there the tree of life, which bare twelv manner of fruits,
and yield her fruit everi month: and the leav of the tree were for
th heal of the nations.

22:3 and there shall be no more curse: but the throne of god and of
th lamb shall be in it; and hi servant shall serv him: 22:4 and
they shall see hi face; and hi name shall be in their foreheads.

22:5 and there shall be no night there; and they need no candle,
neith light of the sun; for the lord god giveth them light: and they
shal reign for ever and ever.

22:6 and he said unto me, these say are faith and true: and the
lord god of the holi prophet sent hi angel to shew unto hi servants
th thing which must shortli be done.

22:7 behold, I come quickly: bless is he that keepeth the say of
th propheci of thi book.

22:8 and I john saw these things, and heard them. and when I had heard
and seen, I fell down to worship befor the feet of the angel which
shew me these things.

22:9 then saith he unto me, see thou do it not: for I am thy
fellowservant, and of thi brethren the prophets, and of them which
keep the say of thi book: worship god.

22:10 and he saith unto me, seal not the say of the propheci of
thi book: for the time is at hand.

22:11 He that is unjust, let him be unjust still: and he which is
filthy, let him be filthi still: and he that is righteous, let him be
right still: and he that is holy, let him be holi still.

22:12 and, behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me, to give
everi man accord as hi work shall be.

22:13 I am alpha and omega, the begin and the end, the first and
th last.

22:14 bless are they that do hi commandments, that they may have
right to the tree of life, and may enter in through the gate into the
city.

22:15 for without are dogs, and sorcerers, and whoremongers, and
murderers, and idolaters, and whosoev loveth and maketh a lie.

22:16 I jesu have sent mine angel to testifi unto you these thing in
th churches. I am the root and the offspr of david, and the bright
and morn star.

22:17 and the spirit and the bride say, come. and let him that heareth
say, come. and let him that is athirst come. and whosoev will, let
him take the water of life freely.

22:18 for I testifi unto everi man that heareth the word of the
propheci of thi book, If ani man shall add unto these things, god
shal add unto him the plagu that are written in thi book: 22:19
and if ani man shall take away from the word of the book of this
prophecy, god shall take away hi part out of the book of life, and
out of the holi city, and from the thing which are written in thi book.

22:20 He which testifieth these thing saith, sure I come quickly.
amen.

even so, come, lord jesus.

22:21 the grace of our lord jesu christ be with you all. amen.
